hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ דִּינֵי מָמוֹנוֹת – בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה, גְּזֵילוֹת וַחֲבָלוֹת – בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה, נֶזֶק וַחֲצִי נֶזֶק, תַּשְׁלוּמֵי כֶפֶל וְתַשְׁלוּמֵי אַרְבָּעָה וַחֲמִשָּׁה – בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה.
human_translation: monetary law by three robbery and injury by three damage half the damage, payment of double and payment of four or five by three
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: Laws of monetary matters - in three categories; thefts and damages - in three categories; damage and half-damage, double payment and four or fivefold payment - in three categories.

hebrew_text: הָאוֹנֵס וְהַמְפַתֶּה וְהַמּוֹצִיא שֵׁם רַע – בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר.
human_translation: one who rapes or one who seduces and a defamer by three the statement of Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: The one who is forced, the one who entices, and the one who defames - in three, the words of Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: מוֹצִיא שֵׁם רַע – בְּעֶשְׂרִים וּשְׁלֹשָׁה, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ דִּינֵי נְפָשׁוֹת.
human_translation: And the Rabbis say: a defamer by twenty-three because includes capital law.
llm_translation: The sages say: One who utters a derogatory name - at twenty-three, because it involves issues of life.

hebrew_text: מַכּוֹת בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה. מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל אָמְרוּ: בְּעֶשְׂרִים וּשְׁלֹשָׁה.
human_translation: lashes by three stated in the name of Rabbi Yishmael: by twenty-three
llm_translation: Stripes in three. In the name of Rabbi Yishmael they said: in twenty and three.

hebrew_text: עִיבּוּר הַחֹדֶשׁ – בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה. עִיבּוּר הַשָּׁנָה – בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה מַתְחִילִין, וּבַחֲמִשָּׁה נוֹשְׂאִין וְנוֹתְנִין, וְגוֹמְרִין בְּשִׁבְעָה. וְאִם גָּמְרוּ בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה – מְעוּבֶּרֶת.
human_translation: intercalation of the month by three intercalation of the year, by three the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: begin with three and they debate with five and they conclude with seven And if they concluded with three a leap
llm_translation: Interpretation of the New Moon - with three. Interpretation of the year - with three, the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: With three they begin, and with five they carry and exchange, and they finish with seven. And if they finished with three - it is a leap year.

hebrew_text: סְמִיכַת זְקֵנִים וַעֲרִיפַת עֶגְלָה – בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: בַּחֲמִשָּׁה. הַחֲלִיצָה וְהַמֵּיאוּנִין – בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה.
human_translation: laying of hands by the Sages and the breaking of the heifer’s neck of three the statement of Rabbi Shimon. Rabbi Yehuda says: of five ḥalitza , and the refusal of three
llm_translation: The leaning of elders and the breaking of the calf - in three, the words of Rabbi Shimon. Rabbi Yehuda says: in five. The redemption and the appraisals - in three.

hebrew_text: נֶטַע רְבָעִי וּמַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי שֶׁאֵין דָּמָיו יְדוּעִין – בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה. הַהֶקְדֵּשׁוֹת – בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה. הָעֲרָכִין הַמִּטַּלְטְלִים – בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אֶחָד מֵהֶן כֹּהֵן.
human_translation: a fourth-year sapling or second-tithe where their value is not known by three consecrated by three the valuations that are movable property by three Rabbi Yehuda says: One of a priest.
llm_translation: Planted fourth and tithe second that its value unknown - in three. Consecrated items - in three. Appraisals that are being moved - in three. Rabbi Yehuda says: one of them is a priest.

hebrew_text: וְהַקַּרְקָעוֹת – תִּשְׁעָה וְכֹהֵן. וְאָדָם – כַּיּוֹצֵא בָּהֶן.
human_translation: And the land nine and, priest. And a person a similar manner to
llm_translation: The floors - nine and a Kohen. And a person - like them.

hebrew_text: דִּינֵי נְפָשׁוֹת – בְּעֶשְׂרִים וּשְׁלֹשָׁה. הָרוֹבֵעַ וְהַנִּרְבָּע – בְּעֶשְׂרִים וּשְׁלֹשָׁה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְהָרַגְתָּ אֶת הָאִשָּׁה וְאֶת הַבְּהֵמָה״, וְאוֹמֵר: ״וְאֶת הַבְּהֵמָה תַּהֲרֹגוּ״.
human_translation: capital law by twenty-three An animal that copulated with a person and an animal that was the object of bestiality by twenty-three as it is stated: you shall kill the woman and the animal” and it states: and you shall kill the animal”
llm_translation: Laws of capital cases - at twenty-three. The one who causes miscarriage and the one who is gored - at twenty-three, as it is stated: "And you shall kill the woman and the animal," and it also says: "And you shall kill the animal."

hebrew_text: שׁוֹר הַנִּסְקָל – בְּעֶשְׂרִים וּשְׁלֹשָׁה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הַשּׁוֹר יִסָּקֵל וְגַם בְּעָלָיו יוּמָת״. כְּמִיתַת בְּעָלִים כָּךְ מִיתַת הַשּׁוֹר. הַזְּאֵב וְהָאֲרִי, הַדּוֹב וְהַנָּמֵר וְהַבַּרְדְּלָס וְהַנָּחָשׁ – מִיתָתָן בְּעֶשְׂרִים וּשְׁלֹשָׁה. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: כׇּל הַקּוֹדֵם לְהוֹרְגָן זָכָה. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: מִיתָתָן בְּעֶשְׂרִים וּשְׁלֹשָׁה.
human_translation: an ox that is stoned by twenty-three as it is stated: the ox shall be stoned and also its owner shall be put to death” just as the death of the owner, so is the death of the ox. a wolf or a lion, a bear or a leopard, or a cheetah, or a snake Their death by twenty-three Rabbi Eliezer says anyone who kills them first merits Rabbi Akiva says: Their death by twenty-three
llm_translation: The ox that is stoned - at twenty-three, as it is stated: "The ox shall be stoned, and also its owner shall die." Just as the death of the owners, so too the death of the ox. The wolf, the lion, the bear, the leopard, the bardelas, and the snake - their death is at twenty-three. Rabbi Eliezer says: Anyone who precedes to kill them is meritorious. Rabbi Akiva says: Their death is at twenty-three.

hebrew_text: אֵין דָּנִין לֹא אֶת הַשֵּׁבֶט, וְלֹא אֶת נְבִיא הַשֶּׁקֶר, וְלֹא אֶת כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל, אֶלָּא עַל פִּי בֵּית דִּין שֶׁל שִׁבְעִים וְאֶחָד. וְאֵין מוֹצִיאִין לְמִלְחֶמֶת הָרְשׁוּת אֶלָּא עַל פִּי בֵּית דִּין שֶׁל שִׁבְעִים וְאֶחָד. אֵין מוֹסִיפִין עַל הָעִיר וְעַל הָעֲזָרוֹת אֶלָּא עַל פִּי בֵּית דִּין שֶׁל שִׁבְעִים וְאֶחָד. אֵין עוֹשִׂין סַנְהֶדְרָיוֹת לַשְּׁבָטִים אֶלָּא עַל פִּי בֵּית דִּין שֶׁל שִׁבְעִים וְאֶחָד.
human_translation: judges tribe or a false prophet or a High Priest only on the basis of a court of seventy-one And bring out to an optional war, only on the basis of a court of seventy-one They may extend the city or the courtyards only on the basis of a court of seventy-one And appoint Sanhedrin for the tribes only on the basis of a court of seventy-one
llm_translation: We do not judge neither the tribe, nor the false prophet, nor the high priest, except by the court of seventy-one. And we do not go out to a discretionary war except by the court of seventy-one. We do not add to the city and to the courtyards except by the court of seventy-one. We do not establish Sanhedrins for the tribes except by the court of seventy-one.

hebrew_text: אֵין עוֹשִׂין עִיר הַנִּדַּחַת, אֶלָּא עַל פִּי בֵּית דִּין שֶׁל שִׁבְעִים וְאֶחָד. אֵין עוֹשִׂין עִיר הַנִּדַּחַת בַּסְּפָר, וְלֹא שָׁלֹשׁ, אֲבָל עוֹשִׂין אַחַת אוֹ שְׁתַּיִם.
human_translation: may be designated an idolatrous city, only in accordance with a court of seventy-one may not designate an idolatrous city on the frontier, and three not But may designate one or two
llm_translation: They do not make a city of refuge, except by the authority of the court of seventy-one. They do not make a city of refuge in a book, nor three, but they make one or two.

hebrew_text: סַנְהֶדְרִין גְּדוֹלָה הָיְתָה שֶׁל שִׁבְעִים וְאֶחָד, וּקְטַנָּה שֶׁל עֶשְׂרִים וּשְׁלֹשָׁה. מִנַּיִן לַגְּדוֹלָה שֶׁהִיא שֶׁל שִׁבְעִים וְאֶחָד? שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אֶסְפָה לִּי שִׁבְעִים אִישׁ מִזִּקְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל״, וּמֹשֶׁה עַל גַּבֵּיהֶן. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: שִׁבְעִים.
human_translation: Great Sanhedrin was of seventy-one and a lesser of twenty-three. From where that the Great was of seventy-one As it is stated: “Gather Me seventy men of the Elders of Israel, and Moses at the head of Rabbi Yehuda says: seventy
llm_translation: Tractate Sanhedrin: The Great Sanhedrin was of seventy-one, and the Small Sanhedrin was of twenty-three. From where do we derive that the Great Sanhedrin is of seventy-one? As it is stated: "Gather for Me seventy men from the elders of Israel," and Moses was among them. Rabbi Yehuda says: Seventy.

hebrew_text: וּמִנַּיִן לַקְּטַנָּה שֶׁהִיא שֶׁל עֶשְׂרִים וּשְׁלֹשָׁה? שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְשָׁפְטוּ הָעֵדָה״, ״וְהִצִּילוּ הָעֵדָה״. עֵדָה שׁוֹפֶטֶת וְעֵדָה מַצֶּלֶת – הֲרֵי כָּאן עֶשְׂרִים.
human_translation: And from where that a lesser is of twenty-three As it is stated: “And the congregation shall judge and the congregation shall save a congregation, judges and a congregation, save there are twenty here.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And from where do we derive that the minimum number of people required for a congregation is twenty-three? As it is stated: "And the congregation shall judge," "And the congregation shall deliver." A congregation that judges and a congregation that delivers - here we have twenty.

hebrew_text: וּמִנַּיִן לְעֵדָה שֶׁהִיא עֲשָׂרָה? שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״עַד מָתַי לָעֵדָה הָרָעָה הַזֹּאת״, יָצְאוּ יְהוֹשֻׁעַ וְכָלֵב.
human_translation: And from where that a congregation of ten As it is stated “How long shall I bear with this evil congregation excluding Joshua and Caleb,
llm_translation: And from where do we derive that an assembly is ten? As it is stated: "How long shall I bear with this evil congregation?" (Numbers 14:27) - Joshua and Caleb came out.

hebrew_text: וּמִנַּיִן לְהָבִיא עוֹד שְׁלֹשָׁה? מִמַּשְׁמַע שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״לֹא תִהְיֶה אַחֲרֵי רַבִּים לְרָעֹת״ שׁוֹמֵעַ אֲנִי שֶׁאֶהְיֶה עִמָּהֶם לְטוֹבָה. אִם כֵּן, לָמָּה נֶאֱמַר ״אַחֲרֵי רַבִּים לְהַטֹּת״? לֹא כְּהַטָּיָיתְךָ לְטוֹבָה הַטָּיָיתְךָ לְרָעָה. הַטָּיָיתְךָ לְטוֹבָה – עַל פִּי אֶחָד, הַטָּיָיתְךָ לְרָעָה – עַל פִּי שְׁנַיִם.
human_translation: And from where to bring three more From the implication of that is stated: “You shall not follow a multitude to convict” I derive that I should follow to exonerate. If so, why is it stated “To incline after a multitude,” Your inclination to exonerate is not like your inclination to convict. Your inclination to exonerate by one your inclination to convict by two.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And from where to bring another three? From what is heard, as it says, "Do not be after the majority for evil" - I hear that I will be with them for good. If so, why is it said, "After the majority to incline"? Not for your inclining for good, but for your inclining for evil. Your inclining for good - by one, your inclining for evil - by two.

hebrew_text: וְאֵין בֵּית דִּין שָׁקוּל, מוֹסִיפִין עֲלֵיהֶם עוֹד אֶחָד. הֲרֵי כָּאן עֶשְׂרִים וּשְׁלֹשָׁה.
human_translation: And a court may not an even they add another one to them, there are twenty-three here.
llm_translation: And a court that is balanced, they add upon them another one. Here there are twenty-three.

hebrew_text: וְכַמָּה יְהֵא בָּעִיר וּתְהֵא רְאוּיָה לְסַנְהֶדְרִין? מֵאָה וְעֶשְׂרִים. רַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה אוֹמֵר: מָאתַיִם וּשְׁלֹשִׁים, כְּנֶגֶד שָׂרֵי עֲשָׂרוֹת.
human_translation: And how many be in the city for to be eligible for Sanhedrin? One hundred and twenty. Rabbi Neḥemya says: Two hundred and thirty, corresponding to the ministers of tens,
llm_translation: "And how many should there be in the city for it to be fit for the Sanhedrin? One hundred and twenty. Rabbi Nechemyah says: Two hundred and thirty, corresponding to the officers of the tens."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אַטּוּ גְּזֵילוֹת וְחַבָּלוֹת לָאו דִּינֵי מָמוֹנוֹת נִינְהוּ? אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: מָה הֵן קָתָנֵי, מָה הֵן דִּינֵי מָמוֹנוֹת? גְּזֵילוֹת וְחַבָּלוֹת. אֲבָל הוֹדָאוֹת וְהַלְוָאוֹת – לָא.
human_translation: Is that to say robbery and injury are not monetary law? Rabbi Abbahu says: teaches What are these, What are these monetary law robbery and injury. But admissions, and loans not
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Are thefts and robberies not considered monetary matters? Rabbi Abbahu said: What are they? What are monetary matters? Thefts and robberies. But admissions and loans - no.

hebrew_text: וּצְרִיכָא, דְּאִי תְּנָא דִּינֵי מָמוֹנוֹת – הֲוָה אָמֵינָא דַּאֲפִילּוּ הוֹדָאוֹת וְהַלְוָאוֹת. תְּנָא גְּזֵילוֹת וַחֲבָלוֹת. וְאִי תְּנָא גְּזֵילוֹת וַחֲבָלוֹת, וְלָא קָתָנֵי דִּינֵי מָמוֹנוֹת – הֲוָה אָמֵינָא הוּא הַדִּין דַּאֲפִילּוּ הוֹדָאוֹת וְהַלְוָאוֹת. וְהַאי דְּקָתָנֵי גְּזֵילוֹת וַחֲבָלוֹת – מִשּׁוּם דְּעִיקַּר שְׁלֹשָׁה דִּכְתִיבִי, בִּגְזֵילוֹת וַחֲבָלוֹת כְּתִיבִי.
human_translation: And is necessary, as had taught monetary law I would say that even admissions and loans. he taught: robbery and injury, And had he taught robbery and injury and had not taught monetary law, I would say the same is true even admissions and loans, And this that teaches robbery and injury, because primary three is written it is written with regard to robbery and injury.
llm_translation: The matter is, for if a Tanna teaches laws of monetary matters - I would say even admissions and loans. If a Tanna teaches about thefts and damages. And if a Tanna teaches about thefts and damages, and does not teach laws of monetary matters - I would say that the law is the same even for admissions and loans. And the reason why thefts and damages are taught is because the Torah primarily mentions three things, it is written about thefts and damages.

hebrew_text: גְּזֵילוֹת, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְנִקְרַב בַּעַל הַבַּיִת אֶל הָאֱלֹהִים״. חֲבָלוֹת – מָה לִי חָבַל בְּגוּפוֹ, מָה לִי חָבַל בְּמָמוֹנוֹ! תְּנָא: מָה הֵן דִּינֵי מָמוֹנוֹת? גְּזֵילוֹת וַחֲבָלוֹת. אֲבָל הוֹדָאוֹת וְהַלְוָאוֹת – לֹא.
human_translation: robbery, as it is written “The owner of the house shall come near the court [ ha’elohim ], injury, what is to me injured one’s body what is to me injured one’s property? taught: What are these monetary law? robbery and injury. But not admissions and loans.
llm_translation: Theft, as it is written: "And the owner of the house shall come near to God." Injuries - what do I care about an injury to his body, what do I care about an injury to his money! A Tanna taught: What are the laws of monetary matters? Theft and injuries. But admissions and loans - no.

hebrew_text: וּלְמַאי? אִילֵּימָא דְּלָא בָּעֵינַן שְׁלֹשָׁה, וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: שְׁנַיִם שֶׁדָּנוּ דִּינֵי מָמוֹנוֹת, לְדִבְרֵי הַכֹּל אֵין דִּינֵיהֶם דִּין.
human_translation: And with regard to which If we say that we do not need three but doesn’t Rabbi Abbahu say: two that adjudicated monetary law everyone agrees their judgment is not judgment,
llm_translation: And for what? Perhaps we do not require three, and Rabbi Avahu said: Two who judge monetary cases, according to everyone their judgment is not a judgment.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: דְּלָא בָּעֵינַן מוּמְחִין.
human_translation: rather, that we do not require expert,
llm_translation: Rather: we do not require blemished ones.

hebrew_text: מַאי קָסָבַר? אִי קָסָבַר עֵירוּב פָּרָשִׁיּוֹת כָּתוּב כָּאן, לִיבְעֵי נָמֵי מוּמְחִין. וְאִי קָסָבַר אֵין עֵירוּב פָּרָשִׁיּוֹת כָּתוּב כָּאן, שְׁלֹשָׁה לְמָה לִי?
human_translation: What does hold? If he holds a merging of portions is written here, he should also require expert And if he holds there is no merging of portions written here, why do I three
llm_translation: What does he hold? If he holds that the laws of Eruv are written here, let him come and learn from the Mishnah. And if he holds that the laws of Eruv are not written here, why do I need three?

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם קָסָבַר: עֵירוּב פָּרָשִׁיּוֹת כָּתוּב כָּאן, וּבְדִין הוּא דְּלִיבְעֵי נָמֵי מוּמְחִין. וְהַאי דְּלָא בָּעֵינַן מוּמְחִין – מִשּׁוּם דְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: דְּבַר תּוֹרָה, אֶחָד דִּינֵי מָמוֹנוֹת וְאֶחָד דִּינֵי נְפָשׁוֹת בִּדְרִישָׁה וּבַחֲקִירָה,
human_translation: Actually, holds a merging of portions is written here, and by right should have required expert as well. And this that we do not require expert due to of Rabbi Ḥanina, as Rabbi Ḥanina says: By Torah law, both monetary law and capital law inquiry and interrogation
llm_translation: Forever he holds: Eruv partitions written here, and in law it is that we require experts. And this that we do not require experts - because of Rabbi Chanina, for Rabbi Chanina said: A matter of Torah, one is laws of monetary matters and one is laws of life in interpretation and investigation.

hebrew_text: שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״מִשְׁפַּט אֶחָד יִהְיֶה לָכֶם״. וּמָה טַעַם אָמְרוּ דִּינֵי מָמוֹנוֹת לָא בָּעֵינַן דְּרִישָׁה וַחֲקִירָה? כְּדֵי שֶׁלֹּא תִּנְעוֹל דֶּלֶת בִּפְנֵי לוֹוִין.
human_translation: as it is stated: “You shall have one manner of law” And what is the reason said monetary law we do not require inquiry and interrogation so as not to lock the door in the face of borrowers.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: As it is stated: "One law shall be for you." And what is the reason they said that laws of monetary matters do not require interpretation and investigation? So that the door will not be locked in the face of borrowers.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, טָעוּ – לֹא יְשַׁלְּמוּ?! כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן אַתָּה נוֹעֵל דֶּלֶת בִּפְנֵי לוֹוִין!
human_translation: If that is so, err they should not pay you are all the more so locking the door in the face of borrowers;
llm_translation: Rather, from now on, they erred - shall they not pay?! All the more so, you are locking the door in front of thieves!

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, תַּרְתֵּי קָתָנֵי: דִּינֵי מָמוֹנוֹת בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה הֶדְיוֹטוֹת, גְּזֵילוֹת וַחֲבָלוֹת בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה מוּמְחִין.
human_translation: If that is so, two are taught monetary law, by three laymen [ hedyotot ], robbery and injury by three expert
llm_translation: So it is, two Tannaim: laws of monetary matters by three laymen, thefts and damages by three experts.

hebrew_text: וְעוֹד, שְׁלֹשָׁה שְׁלֹשָׁה לְמָה לִי?
human_translation: And furthermore, why do I three three
llm_translation: And furthermore, three three what to me?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: תַּרְתֵּי קָתָנֵי, מִשּׁוּם דְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא. רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִיקָא אָמַר: מִדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא חַד נָמֵי כָּשֵׁר, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״בְּצֶדֶק תִּשְׁפֹּט עֲמִיתֶךָ״. אֶלָּא מִשּׁוּם יוֹשְׁבֵי קְרָנוֹת.
human_translation: Rather, Rava said: Two are taught because of Rabbi Ḥanina Rav Aḥa, son of Rav Ika, said: By Torah law, one also valid as it is stated: “In righteousness shall you judge your neighbor” But due to those who sit corners,
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said: Two Tannaim, in the name of Rabbi Chanina. Rav Acha, son of Rav Ika, said: From the Torah, one matter is valid, as it is stated, "In righteousness shall you judge your fellow." Rather, due to the residents of the corners.

hebrew_text: אַטּוּ בִּתְלָתָא מִי לָא הָווּ יוֹשְׁבֵי קְרָנוֹת? אִי אֶפְשָׁר דְּלֵית בְּהוּ חַד דִּגְמִיר. אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, טָעוּ – לֹא יְשַׁלְּמוּ?! כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן דִּנְפִישִׁי יוֹשְׁבֵי קְרָנוֹת!
human_translation: Is that to say with three they not be those who sit corners? it is impossible, that there is not among them one who is learned. If that is so, they err they should not pay all the more so many those who sit corners
llm_translation: Now, in the third year, were there not three who sat at the corners? It is impossible that there was not one who learned. Rather, from now on, they erred - will they not be liable?! All the more so those who sit at the corners!

hebrew_text: מַאי אִיכָּא בֵּין רָבָא לְרַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִיקָא? אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ – דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: שְׁנַיִם שֶׁדָּנוּ, דִּינֵיהֶן דִּין, אֶלָּא שֶׁנִּקְרְאוּ בֵּית דִּין חָצוּף. לְרָבָא לֵית לֵיהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל, לְרַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִיקָא אִית לֵיהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל.
human_translation: What are between Rava, and Rav Aḥa, son of Rav Ika, between that Shmuel says: two adjudicated their judgment judgment, but they are called an impudent court. Rava is of not of Shmuel, Rav Aḥa, son of Rav Ika, is of of Shmuel,
llm_translation: What is the difference between Rava and Rav Acha, son of Rav Ika? The difference between them is as Shmuel said: Two who judged, their judgment is a judgment, except that they were called a brazen court. Rava does not have the teaching of Shmuel, but Rav Acha, son of Rav Ika, has the teaching of Shmuel.

hebrew_text: נֶזֶק וַחֲצִי נֶזֶק וְכוּ׳. נֶזֶק הַיְינוּ חֲבָלוֹת? מִשּׁוּם דְּקָא בָּעֵי לְמִיתְנֵא חֲצִי נֶזֶק, תָּנֵי נָמֵי נֶזֶק שָׁלֵם.
human_translation: damage and half the damage Damage is injury, Since he needed to teach half the damage, he also taught full damage.
llm_translation: Damage and half damage and so forth. Damage, is that referring to ropes? Because it needs to teach half damage, it teaches also complete damage.

hebrew_text: חֲצִי נֶזֶק נָמֵי – הַיְינוּ חֲבָלוֹת! תְּנָא מָמוֹנָא, וְקָתָנֵי קְנָסָא.
human_translation: half the damage is also injury, taught monetary matters, and taught a fine,
llm_translation: Half of the damage is paid - this refers to ropes! It was taught in a Baraita: monetary matters, and the Mishnah teaches penalties.

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר: ״פַּלְגָא נִיזְקָא קְנָסָא״, אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר: ״פַּלְגָא נִיזְקָא מָמוֹנָא״, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר?
human_translation: This works out well according to the one who says the half the damage a fine, But according to the one who says the half the damage monetary what can be said?
llm_translation: He left it for the one who said, "Half is a penalty," but for the one who said, "Half is monetary damage," what can be said?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, אַיְּידֵי דְּקָא בָּעֵי לְמִיתְנֵא תַּשְׁלוּמֵי כֶּפֶל וְתַשְׁלוּמֵי אַרְבָּעָה וַחֲמִשָּׁה, דְּמָמוֹן
human_translation: Rather, since needed to teach payment of double and payment of four or five which money
llm_translation: Rather, since he wants to teach the payments of double and four or fivefold, which are monetary penalties...

hebrew_text: שֶׁאֵינוֹ מִשְׁתַּלֵּם בְּרֹאשׁ הוּא, תְּנָא נָמֵי חֲצִי נֶזֶק, דְּמָמוֹן שֶׁאֵינוֹ מִשְׁתַּלֵּם בְּרֹאשׁ הוּא. וְאַיְּידֵי דְּקָא בָּעֵי לְמִיתְנֵא חֲצִי נֵזֶק, תְּנָא נָמֵי נֵזֶק.
human_translation: that is not paid according to its value, he also taught half the damage, which is money that is not paid according to its value, And since he needs to teach half the damage, he also taught damage.
llm_translation: He who does not take root in the head, it is taught: he pays half the damage, for money that does not take root in the head. And since he wants to teach half the damage, it is taught: he pays full damage.

hebrew_text: שְׁלֹשָׁה מְנָלַן? דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״וְנִקְרַב בַּעַל הַבַּיִת אֶל הָאֱלֹהִים״ – הֲרֵי כָּאן אֶחָד, ״עַד הָאֱלֹהִים יָבֹא דְּבַר שְׁנֵיהֶם״ – הֲרֵי כָּאן שְׁנַיִם, ״אֲשֶׁר יַרְשִׁיעֻן אֱלֹהִים״ – הֲרֵי כָּאן שְׁלֹשָׁה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יֹאשִׁיָּה.
human_translation: From where do we three as the Sages taught: “The owner of the house shall come near the court, there is one here. “The cause of both parties shall come before the court,” there are two here. “He whom the court shall condemn there are three here, the statement of Rabbi Yoshiya.
llm_translation: Three who bring a guilt-offering? For the Rabbis taught: "And the master of the house shall approach unto God" - here is one, "Then both parties shall come before God" - here are two, "Whom God shall condemn" - here are three, the words of Rabbi Yoshiyah.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן אוֹמֵר: רִאשׁוֹן תְּחִילָּה נֶאֱמַר, וְאֵין דּוֹרְשִׁין תְּחִילּוֹת. אֶלָּא ״עַד הָאֱלֹהִים יָבֹא דְּבַר שְׁנֵיהֶם״ – הֲרֵי כָּאן אֶחָד, ״אֲשֶׁר יַרְשִׁיעֻן אֱלֹהִים״ – הֲרֵי כָּאן שְׁנַיִם, וְאֵין בֵּית דִּין שָׁקוּל. מוֹסִיפִין עֲלֵיהֶן עוֹד אֶחָד – הֲרֵי כָּאן שְׁלֹשָׁה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yonatan says: The first is stated first And one does not derive first Rather, “The cause of both parties shall come before the court,” there is one here, “He whom the court shall condemn” there are two here. And a court may not an even they add an additional one to them, there are three here.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yonatan says: "First, it was said, and we do not interpret beginnings. Rather, 'unto God shall come the matter of both of them' - here is one, 'whom God shall condemn' - here are two, and there is no balanced court. We add one more to them - here are three."

hebrew_text: נֵימָא בְּדוֹרְשִׁין תְּחִילּוֹת קָמִיפַּלְגִי? דְּמָר סָבַר: דּוֹרְשִׁין תְּחִילּוֹת, וּמַר סָבַר: אֵין דּוֹרְשִׁין תְּחִילּוֹת. לָא, דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא אֵין דּוֹרְשִׁין תְּחִילּוֹת. אָמַר לָךְ רַבִּי יֹאשִׁיָּה: אִם כֵּן, נֵימָא קְרָא ״וְנִקְרַב בַּעַל הַבַּיִת אֶל הַשּׁוֹפֵט״. מַאי ״אֶל הָאֱלֹהִים״? שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ לְמִנְיָינָא.
human_translation: Let us say disagree with regard to one derives first As Sage, holds one derives first and Sage, holds one does not derive first No, everyone one does not derive first Rabbi Yoshiya said to you: If it is true let the verse say: The owner of the house shall come near to the judge [ hashofet ]. What, “To the court [ haelohim ]”? Conclude from it to the tally.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Neima b'dorshin techilot kamifalgi? DeMar savar: Dorshin techilot, uMar savar: Ein dorshin techilot. La, dechulei olma ein dorshin techilot. Amar lakh Rabbi Yoshiya: Im kein, neima kra 'venikrav baal habayit el hashofet'. Mai 'el haElohim'? Shema minah leminyana." English translation: "Is it said that the early authorities disagree? For Mar holds: they do expound the beginnings, and Mar holds: they do not expound the beginnings. No, the entire world does not expound the beginnings. Rabbi Yoshiya said to you: If so, is it said 'and the master of the house shall approach the judge'. What is 'to the judges'? Learn from it for a comparison."

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹנָתָן, לִישָּׁנָא דְּעָלְמָא נְקַט, כִּדְאָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי: מַאן דְּאִית לֵיהּ דִּינָא – לִיקְרַב לְגַבֵּי דַּיָּינָא.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yonatan employed the language of the world, as people say: One who has a case, should approach the judge,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yonatan acquired a cloak of the world, as people say: Whoever has a lawsuit - should come close to the judge.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יֹאשִׁיָּה לֵית לֵיהּ בֵּית דִּין נוֹטֶה? וְהָתַנְיָא: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בְּנוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי אוֹמֵר, מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״לִנְטֹת אַחֲרֵי רַבִּים לְהַטֹּת״? הַתּוֹרָה אָמְרָה: עֲשֵׂה לְךָ בֵּית דִּין נוֹטֶה.
human_translation: But doesn’t Rabbi Yoshiya accept a court an odd And isn’t it taught Rabbi Eliezer, son of Rabbi Yosei HaGelili, says: What the verse states: “To incline after a multitude to pervert justice” the Torah is saying Make for yourself a court incline
llm_translation: Rabbi Yoshiyah does not have a leaning court? And it was taught: Rabbi Eliezer, son of Rabbi Yosei the Galilean, says, what is the teaching to say "to follow the majority to incline"? The Torah said: Establish for yourself a leaning court.

hebrew_text: סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, דְּאָמַר: שִׁבְעִים. דִּתְנַן: סַנְהֶדְרִי גְּדוֹלָה הָיְתָה שֶׁל שִׁבְעִים וְאֶחָד, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: שִׁבְעִים.
human_translation: holds in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda, who says: seventy As we learned Great Sanhedrin was of seventy-one Rabbi Yehuda says: seventy
llm_translation: He thought according to Rabbi Yehuda, who said: seventy. As we learned: The Great Sanhedrin consisted of seventy-one, Rabbi Yehuda says: seventy.

hebrew_text: אֵימַר דְּשָׁמְעַתְּ לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה בְּסַנְהֶדְרִי גְּדוֹלָה, דִּכְתִיבִי קְרָאֵי. בִּשְׁאָר בֵּי דִינָא מִי שָׁמְעַתְּ לֵיהּ?
human_translation: Say that you heard Rabbi Yehuda to the Great Sanhedrin, which verses are written, Have you heard him with regard to the rest of the courts,
llm_translation: Statement: If you heard it to Rabbi Yehuda in the Great Sanhedrin, for it is written in the Scriptures. In other courts, who heard it?

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא: לָא שְׁנָא, וְהָתְנַן: סְמִיכַת זְקֵנִים וַעֲרִיפַת עֶגְלָה בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: בַּחֲמִשָּׁה.
human_translation: And if you would say: There is no difference; but didn’t we learn laying of hands by the Sages and the breaking of the heifer’s neck of three the statement of Rabbi Shimon. Rabbi Yehuda says: of five
llm_translation: And if you will say: It is not different, but we learned in a Mishnah: The leaning of the elders and the breaking of the calf require three, according to the words of Rabbi Shimon. Rabbi Yehuda says: with five.

hebrew_text: וְאָמְרִינַן: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה? ״וְסָמְכוּ״ – שְׁנַיִם, ״זִקְנֵי״ – שְׁנַיִם, וְאֵין בֵּית דִּין שָׁקוּל, מוֹסִיפִין עֲלֵיהֶן עוֹד אֶחָד, הֲרֵי כָּאן חֲמִשָּׁה.
human_translation: And we say What is the reasoning of Rabbi Yehuda? “Shall lay their hands,” two, “Elders,” two, And a court may not an even we add another one to them, there are five here.
llm_translation: And we say: What is the reason for Rabbi Yehuda? "And they leaned" - two, "the elders" - two, and if the court is evenly split, they add one more, thus here are five.

hebrew_text: דְּרַבִּי יֹאשִׁיָּה עֲדִיפָא מִדְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, דְּאִילּוּ רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בְּסַנְהֶדְרִי גְּדוֹלָה הוּא דְּלֵית לֵיהּ, הָא בִּשְׁאָר בֵּי דִינָא אִית לֵיהּ. וְרַבִּי יֹאשִׁיָּה בִּשְׁאָר בֵּי דִינָא נָמֵי לֵית לֵיהּ. וְאֶלָּא הַאי ״לִנְטֹת״ מַאי עָבֵיד לֵיהּ? מוֹקֵים לֵהּ בְּדִינֵי נְפָשׁוֹת.
human_translation: that Rabbi Yoshiya of Rabbi Yehuda goes further than because Rabbi Yehuda does not accept with a Great Sanhedrin, but with regard to other courts he does accept And Rabbi Yoshiya also does not accept with regard to other courts. And what does he do with this “To incline interprets it in capital law.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yoshiyah is superior to Rabbi Yehudah, for even though Rabbi Yehudah is a member of the Great Sanhedrin, he does not have the same authority, whereas in other courts he does. And Rabbi Yoshiyah, in other courts, does not have the same authority. But what does this word "linetot" do for him? It establishes him in matters of capital punishment.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל בְּדִינֵי מָמוֹנוֹת – לָא? אֶלָּא הָא דִּתְנַן: שְׁנַיִם אוֹמְרִים זַכַּאי וְאֶחָד אוֹמֵר חַיָּיב – זַכַּאי, שְׁנַיִם אוֹמְרִים חַיָּיב וְאֶחָד אוֹמֵר זַכַּאי – חַיָּיב. נֵימָא דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי יֹאשִׁיָּה?
human_translation: But does not with regard to monetary law? But that which we learned two say exempt and one says liable, exempt; two say liable and one says exempt, liable. Let us say that not in accordance with Rabbi Yoshiya,
llm_translation: But in cases of monetary matters - no? Rather, as we learned: Two say "innocent" and one says "guilty" - "innocent"; two say "guilty" and one says "innocent" - "guilty." Should we say this is not like Rabbi Yoshiyah?

hebrew_text: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבִּי יֹאשִׁיָּה, מַיְיתֵי לַהּ בְּקַל וָחוֹמֶר מִדִּינֵי נְפָשׁוֹת: וּמָה דִּינֵי נְפָשׁוֹת דַּחֲמִירִי, אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא ״זִיל בָּתַר רוּבָּא״, דִּינֵי מָמוֹנוֹת לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן?
human_translation: You even say Rabbi Yoshiya. He derives this on an a fortiori from capital law: If capital law, which are strict, the Merciful One states Follow the majority, monetary law, not all the more so
llm_translation: Even if you say it is Rabbi Yoshiyah, he brings to it with a fortiori argument from the laws of capital cases. And what are the laws of capital cases that are stringent? The Merciful One says, "Go after the majority," so how much more so in monetary cases?

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: דִּינֵי מָמוֹנוֹת בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה, רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: בַּחֲמִשָּׁה, כְּדֵי שֶׁיִּגָּמֵר הַדִּין בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה. אַטּוּ בִּתְלָתָא מִי לָא גָּמַר דִינָא בִּתְרֵי? הָכִי קָאָמַר: מִפְּנֵי שֶׁגְּמַר דִּין בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה. אַלְמָא קָסָבַר: תְּלָתָא כִּי כְּתִיבִי – בִּגְמַר דִינָא כְּתִיבִי.
human_translation: The Sages taught: monetary law by three Rabbi says: by five so that a verdict can be issued with three Is that to say of three a verdict cannot be issued by two This is is saying: due to that a verdict by three. Evidently, holds when three is written is written with regard to the verdict.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: Monetary cases are judged by three judges, Rabbi says: By five, so that the judgment will be completed by three. But if judgment is not completed by three, will it be completed by two? This is what he is saying: Because judgment is completed by three. This implies that he holds: When it is written three, it is written for the completion of judgment.

hebrew_text: מְגַדֵּף בַּהּ רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, תְּהֵא סַנְהֶדְרִי גְּדוֹלָה צְרִיכָה מֵאָה וְאַרְבָּעִים וְאֶחָד, כְּדֵי שֶׁיִּגָּמֵר הַדִּין בְּשִׁבְעִים וְאֶחָד? וּתְהֵא סַנְהֶדְרִי קְטַנָּה צְרִיכָה אַרְבָּעִים וַחֲמִשָּׁה, כְּדֵי שֶׁיִּגָּמֵר הַדִּין בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה וְעֶשְׂרִים?
human_translation: Rabbi Abbahu ridicule [ megaddef ] this If that is so, the Great Sanhedrin would need 141 so that the verdict can be issued by seventy-one, and a lesser Sanhedrin would need forty-five so that the verdict can be issued by twenty-three.
llm_translation: The one who reviled Rabbi Avahu: Rather from now on, the Great Sanhedrin shall consist of one hundred and forty-one, so that the judgment may be completed in seventy-one? And the Small Sanhedrin shall consist of forty-five, so that the judgment may be completed in twenty-three?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא ״אֶסְפָה לִּי שִׁבְעִים אִישׁ״ אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא, מִשְּׁעַת אֲסִיפָה שִׁבְעִים. ״וְשָׁפְטוּ הָעֵדָה וְהִצִּילוּ הָעֵדָה״ נָמֵי, מִשְּׁעַת שְׁפִיטַת הָעֵדָה. הָכִי נָמֵי: ״וְנִקְרַב בַּעַל הַבַּיִת אֶל הָאֱלֹהִים״, מִשְּׁעַת קְרִיבָה שְׁלֹשָׁה.
human_translation: Rather, the Merciful One states: “Gather Me seventy men from the time of gathering, seventy. “And the congregation shall judge…and the congregation shall save” also from the time that the congregation judges Similarly, “The owner of the house shall come near to the court” from the time of coming near three
llm_translation: Rather, "Gather for me seventy men," the Merciful One said, from the time of the gathering seventy. "And the congregation shall judge, and the congregation shall save," similarly, from the time of the judgment of the congregation. So it is said: "And the master of the house shall approach to God," from the time of offering three.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, הַיְינוּ טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי: ״אֲשֶׁר יַרְשִׁיעֻן אֱלֹהִים״ – תְּרֵי. נֶאֱמַר ״אֱלֹהִים״ לְמַטָּה וְנֶאֱמַר ״אֱלֹהִים״ לְמַעְלָה. מָה לְמַטָּה שְׁנַיִם, אַף לְמַעְלָה שְׁנַיִם. וְאֵין בֵּית דִּין שָׁקוּל – מוֹסִיפִין עֲלֵיהֶם עוֹד אֶחָד. הֲרֵי כָּאן חֲמִשָּׁה.
human_translation: Rather, this is the reasoning of Rabbi “He whom the court shall condemn” two it is stated: “The court,” below and it is stated: “The court,” above. Just as below two so too above two And a court may not an even they add another one to them, so there are five here.
llm_translation: Rather, this is the reason of Rabbi: "God will judge" - two. It is stated "God" below and it is stated "God" above. Just as below there are two, so too above there are two. And a court that is balanced - they add one more. Here there are five.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן: ״יַרְשִׁיעֻן״ כְּתִיב.
human_translation: And the Rabbis “Shall condemn” written
llm_translation: The Sages: "Yarshi'un" is written.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק בַּר יוֹסֵי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: רַבִּי, וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן רוֹעֵץ, וּבֵית שַׁמַּאי, וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא – כּוּלְּהוּ סְבִירָא לְהוּ יֵשׁ אֵם לַמִּקְרָא.
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzḥak bar Yosei says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Rabbi Rabbi Yehuda ben Roetz, Beit Shammai, Rabbi Shimon, and Rabbi Akiva, they all hold vocalization is authoritative,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yitzchak bar Yosei said, Rabbi Yochanan said: Rabbi, and Rabbi Yehuda ben Roetz, and Beit Shammai, and Rabbi Shimon, and Rabbi Akiva - all of them hold that there is a mother to the Scripture.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי, הָא דַּאֲמַרַן.
human_translation: Rabbi that which we have said,
llm_translation: Rabbi, the one we said.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן רוֹעֵץ, דְּתַנְיָא: שָׁאֲלוּ תַּלְמִידִים אֶת רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן רוֹעֵץ: אֶקְרָא אֲנִי ״שִׁבְעִים״, יָכוֹל תְּהֵא יוֹלֶדֶת נְקֵבָה טְמֵאָה שִׁבְעִים?
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda ben Roetz, as it is taught students asked Rabbi Yehuda ben Roetz: I can read “Seventy [ shivim ] might gives birth to a female should be impure seventy
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda ben Roetz said in a teaching: The students asked Rabbi Yehuda ben Roetz: If I say "seventy," can a female impure give birth to seventy?

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָהֶן: טִימֵּא וְטִיהֵר בַּזָּכָר, וְטִימֵּא וְטִיהֵר בַּנְּקֵבָה. מָה כְּשֶׁטִּיהֵר בַּזָּכָר – בַּנְּקֵבָה כִּפְלַיִם, אַף כְּשֶׁטִּימֵּא בַּזָּכָר – בַּנְּקֵבָה כִּפְלַיִם.
human_translation: said to them: deemed impure and deemed pure to a male, and deemed impure and deemed pure to a female. Just as when it deemed pure to a male, to a female double so too, when it deemed impure to a male, to a female double
llm_translation: He said to them: "He became impure and became pure in the male, and he became impure and became pure in the female. Just as when he became pure in the male - in the female it is doubled, so too when he became impure in the male - in the female it is doubled."

hebrew_text: לְאַחַר שֶׁיָּצְאוּ, יָצָא וּמַחֲזִיר אַחֲרֵיהֶם. אָמַר לָהֶן: אִי אַתֶּם זְקוּקִים לְכָךְ. ״שְׁבוּעַיִים״ קָרֵינַן, וְיֵשׁ אֵם לַמִּקְרָא.
human_translation: After they left, went out and followed them. said to them: You do not need this we read “Two weeks,” and vocalization is authoritative.
llm_translation: After they went out, he went out and brought them back. He said to them: "Are you not needed for this?" We read "oaths," and there is a mother to the verse.

hebrew_text: בֵּית שַׁמַּאי, דִּתְנַן: בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים, כׇּל הַנִּיתָּנִין עַל מִזְבֵּחַ הַחִיצוֹן שֶׁנְּתָנָן בְּמַתָּנָה אַחַת – כִּיפֵּר, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְדַם זְבָחֶיךָ יִשָּׁפֵךְ״. וּבְחַטָּאת – שְׁתֵּי מַתָּנוֹת. וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: אַף בְּחַטָּאת שֶׁנְּתָנָן בְּמַתָּנָה אַחַת – כִּיפֵּר.
human_translation: Beit Shammai, as we learned Beit Shammai say: all whose presented on the external altar, presented with one presentation has effected atonement, as it is stated: “And the blood of your offerings shall be poured out But with regard to a sin-offering, two presentations. And Beit Hillel say: Even with regard to a sin-offering that one presented with one presentation, it has effected atonement
llm_translation: House of Shammai, as we learned: House of Shammai says, "All offerings placed on the outer altar that were given as a single gift - atone, as it is stated: 'And the blood of your sacrifices shall be poured out.' And for a sin offering - two gifts. And House of Hillel says: Even for a sin offering that was given as a single gift - atone."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב הוּנָא: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּבֵית שַׁמַּאי? ״קַרְנֹת״, ״קַרְנֹת״, ״קַרְנֹת״ – הֲרֵי כָּאן שֵׁשׁ: אַרְבַּע לְמִצְוָה, וּשְׁתַּיִם לְעַכֵּב.
human_translation: And Rav Huna says: What is the reasoning of Beit Shammai? horns horns horns there are six here. Four for the mitzva, and two to invalidate
llm_translation: And Rav Huna said: What is the reason for Beit Shammai? "Horns," "horns," "horns" - here there are six: four for the commandment, and two to delay.

hebrew_text: וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: קַרְנוֹת, קַרְנַת, קַרְנַת – הֲרֵי כָּאן אַרְבַּע. שָׁלֹשׁ לְמִצְוָה, וְאַחַת לְעַכֵּב.
human_translation: And Beit Hillel say: “horns” “horns” “horns” there are four here. Three to a mitzva, And one, to invalidates
llm_translation: House of Hillel says: "Karnot, Karnat, Karnat - here are four. Three for the commandment, and one to delay."

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא: כּוּלְּהוּ לְמִצְוָה? כַּפָּרָה בִּכְדִי לָא אַשְׁכְּחַן!
human_translation: But say all of them are for the mitzva We have not found atonement with no
llm_translation: And why? All for the commandment? The atonement is not forgotten!

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, דְּתַנְיָא: שְׁתַּיִם כְּהִלְכָתָן, וּשְׁלִישִׁית אֲפִילּוּ טֶפַח. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: שָׁלֹשׁ כְּהִלְכָתָן, וּרְבִיעִית אֲפִילּוּ טֶפַח. בְּמַאי קָמִיפַּלְגִי? רַבָּנַן סָבְרִי: יֵשׁ אֵם לַמָּסוֹרֶת, וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן סָבַר: יֵשׁ אֵם לַמִּקְרָא.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon, as it is taught two in their standard sense, and a third even handbreadth. Rabbi Shimon says three in their standard sense, and a fourth even handbreadth. With regard to what do they disagree? The Rabbis hold tradition is authoritative, and Rabbi Shimon holds that vocalization is authoritative.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon, as it was taught: Two according to their law, and a third even a handbreadth. Rabbi Shimon says: Three according to their law, and a fourth even a handbreadth. What are they arguing about? The Rabbis hold: There is a mother for tradition, and Rabbi Shimon holds: There is a mother for Scripture.

hebrew_text: רַבָּנַן סָבְרִי: יֵשׁ אֵם לַמָּסוֹרֶת. ״בַּסֻּכָּת״, ״בַּסֻּכָּת״, ״בַּסֻּכּוֹת״ – הֲרֵי כָּאן אַרְבַּע. דַּל חַד קְרָא לְגוּפֵיהּ, פָּשׁוּ לְהוּ תְּלָת. אֲתַאי הִלְכְתָא, גְרַעְתָּא לִשְׁלִישִׁית, וְאוֹקֵימְתָּא אַטֶּפַח.
human_translation: The Rabbis hold that tradition is authoritative. in sukkot ” in sukkot ” in sukkot ,” there are four here. Remove one verse, to itself, three remain. The halakha comes reduces the third and establishes it as handbreadth.
llm_translation: The sages hold: There is a mother to the tradition. "In the sukkah," "in the sukkah," "in the sukkot" – here are four. One verse for itself, they interpreted it as three. A teaching came, you subtracted a third, and you established a handbreadth.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן סָבַר: ״בַּסֻּכֹּת״, ״בַּסֻּכֹּת״, ״בַּסֻּכּוֹת״ – הֲרֵי כָּאן שֵׁשׁ. דַּל חַד קְרָא לְגוּפֵיהּ, פָּשׁוּ לְהוּ אַרְבַּע. אֲתַאי הִלְכְתָא גְרַעְתָּא לִרְבִיעִית, וְאוֹקְמֵיהּ אַטֶּפַח.
human_translation: And Rabbi Shimon holds in sukkot ,” in sukkot ,” in sukkot ,” there are six here. Remove one verse to itself, four remain. The halakha comes reduces the fourth and establishes it at handbreadth.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon holds: "in the sukkot," "in the sukkot," "in the sukkah" - here are six. One verse is for itself, they explained it as four. A halacha came and diminished it to a quarter, and established it as a handbreadth.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, דְּתַנְיָא: רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר, מִנַּיִין לִרְבִיעִית דָּם שֶׁיָּצְאָה מִשְּׁנֵי מֵתִים שֶׁמְּטַמֵּא בְּאֹהֶל? שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״עַל כׇּל נַפְשֹׁת מֵת לֹא יָבֹא״ – שְׁתֵּי נְפָשׁוֹת וְשִׁיעוּר אֶחָד. וְרַבָּנַן: ״נפשת״ כְּתִיב.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva, as it is taught Rabbi Akiva says: From where that a quarter of blood that came out of two corpses imparts ritual impurity in a tent? As it is stated “He shall not come upon any dead bodies” one measure two bodies. And the Rabbis “bodies” is written
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva, as it was taught: Rabbi Akiva says, from where do we derive the impurity of a quarter-log of blood that emerged from two corpses in a tent? As it is stated: "Upon every soul of the dead, he shall not come" - two souls and one measure. And the Rabbis say: "souls" is written.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב: מִי אִיכָּא דְּלֵית לֵיהּ ״יֵשׁ אֵם לַמִּקְרָא״? וְהָתַנְיָא: ״בַּחֲלֵב אִמּוֹ״ – יָכוֹל ״בְּחֵלֶב״?
human_translation: Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov objects to Is there who does not accept vocalization is authoritative? But isn’t it taught in its mother’s milk [ baḥalev ]” might in the fat [ beḥelev ]
llm_translation: The Gemara challenges it: Rav Ahah bar Yaakov said to it: Is there a case where there is no "there is a mother to the verse"? But it was taught in a baraita: "In the milk of its mother" - could it be "in fat"?

hebrew_text: אָמַרְתָּ: יֵשׁ אֵם לַמִּקְרָא.
human_translation: You say vocalization is authoritative,
llm_translation: You said: there is a mother to the scripture.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא יֵשׁ אֵם לַמִּקְרָא, וְרַבִּי וְרַבָּנַן בְּהָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי: רַבִּי סָבַר ״יַרְשִׁיעֻן אֱלֹהִים״ – אַחֲרִינֵי, וְרַבָּנַן סָבְרִי ״יַרְשִׁיעֻן״ – דְּהַאיְךְ וְהַאי.
human_translation: Rather, everyone vocalization is authoritative. But Rabbi and the Rabbis disagree with regard to this: Rabbi holds “the court shall condemn” other the Rabbis hold “shall condemn” these those
llm_translation: Rather, the entirety of the world has a mother to the Scripture, and Rabbi and the Rabbis disagree on this matter: Rabbi holds "God will judge" - in the future, and the Rabbis hold "they will be judged" - this one and that one.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן רוֹעֵץ, לָא פְּלִיגִי רַבָּנַן עֲלֵיהּ.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda ben Roetz, the Rabbis do not disagree with him,
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda ben Roetz, do not dispute the Rabbis about it.

hebrew_text: בֵּית הִלֵּל, דְּתַנְיָא: ״וְכִפֶּר״, ״וְכִפֶּר״, ״וְכִפֶּר״ – מִפְּנֵי הַדִּין.
human_translation: Beit Hillel, as it is taught “And shall make atonement shall make atonement “And shall make atonement due to the logical inference:
llm_translation: Beit Hillel, as it was taught: "And he shall make atonement," "And he shall make atonement," "And he shall make atonement" - due to the judgment.

hebrew_text: וַהֲלֹא דִין הוּא: נֶאֱמַר דָּמִים לְמַטָּה, וְנֶאֱמַר דָּמִים לְמַעְלָה. מָה דָּמִים הָאֲמוּרִים לְמַטָּה – שֶׁנְּתָנָן בְּמַתָּנָה אַחַת כִּיפֵּר, אַף דָּמִים הָאֲמוּרִים לְמַעְלָה – שֶׁנְּתָנָן בְּמַתָּנָה אַחַת כִּיפֵּר.
human_translation: Could this not inference? is stated blood below, and is stated blood above, Just as blood that is stated below, when it is presented with one presentation it has effected atonement, so too blood that is stated above, when it is presented with one presentation it has effected atonement.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: And isn't it so: it is stated blood below, and it is stated blood above. Just as the blood mentioned below - that it atoned with one gift, so too the blood mentioned above - that it atoned with one gift.

hebrew_text: אוֹ כְּלָךְ לְדֶרֶךְ זוֹ: נֶאֱמַר דָּמִים בַּחוּץ, וְנֶאֱמַר דָּמִים בִּפְנִים. מָה דָּמִים הָאֲמוּרִים בִּפְנִים – חִיסֵּר אַחַת מִמַּתָּנוֹת לֹא עָשָׂה וְלֹא כְּלוּם, אַף דָּמִים הָאֲמוּרִים בַּחוּץ – חִיסֵּר אַחַת מִמַּתָּנוֹת לֹא עָשָׂה כְּלוּם.
human_translation: Or go this way, is stated blood with regard to the external and is stated blood with regard to inner Just as blood that was stated concerning inner one of the presentations is lacking it has not accomplished anything so too, blood that was stated concerning the external of the presentations is lacking it has accomplished nothing.
llm_translation: Or like to this: It is stated blood outside, and it is stated blood inside. What blood is mentioned inside - he omitted one of the gifts and did not complete them, so too blood mentioned outside - he omitted one of the gifts and did not complete them.

hebrew_text: נִרְאֶה לְמִי דּוֹמֶה? דָּנִין חוּץ מִחוּץ, וְאֵין דָּנִין חוּץ מִפְּנִים.
human_translation: Let us see to which this is similar. We derive external from external but we do not derive external from inner
llm_translation: It appears to whom is it similar? We judge outside from outside, and we do not judge outside from inside.

hebrew_text: אוֹ כְּלָךְ לְדֶרֶךְ זוֹ: דָּנִין חַטָּאת וְאַרְבַּע קְרָנוֹת, מֵחַטָּאת וְאַרְבַּע קְרָנוֹת, וְאַל יוֹכִיחַ זֶה, שֶׁאֵין חַטָּאת וְאַרְבַּע קְרָנוֹת.
human_translation: Or go this way: We derive sin-offering four corners from a sin-offering four corners and this which is not a sin-offering four corners cannot prove
llm_translation: Or like this for the way: they judge the sin offering with four horns, from the sin offering with four horns, and this one should not prove, that there is no sin offering with four horns.

hebrew_text: תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְכִפֶּר״, ״וְכִפֶּר״, ״וְכִפֶּר״ – מִפְּנֵי הַדִּין. ״כִּיפֵּר״ – אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁלֹּא נָתַן אֶלָּא שְׁלֹשָׁה, ״כִּיפֵּר״ – אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁלֹּא נָתַן אֶלָּא שְׁתַּיִם, ״כִּיפֵּר״ – אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁלֹּא נָתַן אֶלָּא אַחַת.
human_translation: the verse states: “And shall make atonement,” “And shall make atonement,” “And shall make atonement,” due to the logical inference. shall make atonement,” even though he presented only three shall make atonement,” even though he presented only two shall make atonement,” even though he presented only one
llm_translation: The Talmud teaches: "And he shall atone," "And he shall atone," "And he shall atone" – due to strict judgment. "He shall atone" – even though he only gave three; "he shall atone" – even though he only gave two; "he shall atone" – even though he only gave one.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן וְרַבָּנַן בְּהָא פְּלִיגִי: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן סָבַר, סְכָכָא לָא בָּעֵי קְרָא. וְרַבָּנַן סָבְרִי, סְכָכָא בָּעֵי קְרָא.
human_translation: And Rabbi Shimon and the Rabbis, with regard to this they disagree: Rabbi Shimon holds the roofing [ sekhakha ] does not need a verse And the Rabbis hold roofing does need a verse.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon and the Rabbis dispute this: Rabbi Shimon holds that a sukkah does not require a verse, and the Rabbis hold that a sukkah does require a verse.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא וְרַבָּנַן, בְּהָא פְּלִיגִי: רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא סָבַר ״נְפָשֹׁת״ – תַּרְתֵּי מַשְׁמַע, וְרַבָּנַן סָבְרִי ״נְפָשֹׁת״ – דְּעָלְמָא מַשְׁמַע.
human_translation: And Rabbi Akiva and the Rabbis, with regard to this they disagree: Rabbi Akiva holds “bodies” indicates two. And the Rabbis hold “bodies” indicates general
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva and the Rabbis, in this matter they dispute: Rabbi Akiva holds "nafashot" - implies two, and the Rabbis hold "nafashot" - implies the world.

hebrew_text: וּדְכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא יֵשׁ אֵם לַמִּקְרָא? וְהָתַנְיָא: ״לְטוֹטֶפֶת״, ״לְטֹטֶפֶת״, ״לְטוֹטָפוֹת״ – הֲרֵי כָּאן אַרְבַּע, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל.
human_translation: And does everyone vocalization is authoritative? But isn’t it taught for totafot for totafot for totafot There are four here, the statement of Rabbi Yishmael.
llm_translation: "And are there any superfluous words in the Torah? But it was taught: 'to totafet,' 'to totefet,' 'to totafot' - here are four, the words of Rabbi Yishmael."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ, טַט בְּכַתְפִּי שְׁתַּיִם, פַּת בְּאַפְרִיקִי שְׁתַּיִם.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: There is no need tat in Katfei two, pat in Afriki two,
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: It is not necessary, a tit on my shoulder two, a loaf in Afriki two.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, לְעוֹלָם פְּלִיגִי. וְהָנֵי מִילֵּי כִּי פְּלִיגִי – הֵיכָא דְּשָׁנֵי קְרָא מִמָּסוֹרֶת. אֲבָל הַאי ״חֵלֶב״ וַ״חֲלֵב״ דְּכִי הֲדָדֵי נִינְהוּ, יֵשׁ אֵם לַמִּקְרָא.
human_translation: Rather, actually disagree And this statement, that they disagree where the vocalization differs from the tradition But this milk [ ḥalev ] and fat [ ḥelev ] are an identical vocalization is authoritative.
llm_translation: Rather, they indeed disagree. And these matters when they disagree - where they differ in the tradition. But this "chelev" and "chalev" which are identical, there is a mother for the verse.

hebrew_text: וַהֲרֵי ״יִרְאֶה״ ״יֵרָאֶה״ דְּכִי הֲדָדֵי נִינְהוּ, וּפְלִיגִי? דְּתַנְיָא: יוֹחָנָן בֶּן דַּהֲבַאי אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן תֵּימָא: הַסּוֹמֵא בְּאַחַת מֵעֵינָיו – פָּטוּר מִן הָרְאִיָּה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״יִרְאֶה״ ״יֵרָאֶה״ – כְּדֶרֶךְ שֶׁבָּא לִרְאוֹת כָּךְ בָּא לֵירָאוֹת. מָה לִרְאוֹת בִּשְׁתֵּי עֵינָיו, אַף לֵירָאוֹת בִּשְׁתֵּי עֵינָיו.
human_translation: But “Shall see” “shall appear” are an identical and disagree As it is taught Yoḥanan ben Dahavai says in the name of Rabbi Yehuda ben Teima: One who is blind in one of his eyes is exempt from the appearance, as it is stated: yireh , Shall see, yera’eh , Shall appear. in the manner that one comes to see, so he comes to appear, Just as to see with both of one’s eyes, so too, to appear with both his eyes.
llm_translation: Behold, "yireh" "yera'eh" since they are the same, and they argue? For it was taught: Yochanan ben Dahavai says in the name of Rabbi Yehuda ben Tema: One who is blind in one of his eyes is exempt from seeing, as it is stated "yireh" "yera'eh" - just as he came to see, so he came to fear. Just as to see with both eyes, so too to fear with both eyes.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִיקָא: אָמַר קְרָא ״לֹא תְבַשֵּׁל גְּדִי״, דֶּרֶךְ בִּישּׁוּל אָסְרָה תּוֹרָה.
human_translation: Rather, Rav Aḥa, son of Rav Ika, said: the verse states: “You shall not cook a young goat” the Torah prohibited the manner of cooking,
llm_translation: Rather, said Rav Acha, son of Rav Ika: The verse says, "You shall not cook a kid," indicating that Torah prohibited cooking in its usual manner.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: דִּינֵי מָמוֹנוֹת בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה,
human_translation: The Sages taught monetary law by three
llm_translation: The sages taught: The laws of monetary matters are in three categories.

hebrew_text: וְאִם הָיָה מוּמְחֶה לְרַבִּים, דָּן אֲפִילּוּ יְחִידִי. אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: כְּגוֹן אֲנָא דָּן דִּינֵי מָמוֹנוֹת בִּיחִידִי. וְכֵן אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא: כְּגוֹן אֲנָא דָּן דִּינֵי מָמוֹנוֹת בִּיחִידִי.
human_translation: But if was an expert for the public, he may judge even lone Rav Naḥman said: such as I may judge monetary law as lone And similarly, Rabbi Ḥiyya said: such as I may judge monetary law as lone
llm_translation: "And if he was appointed to judge the public, he judges even an individual. Rav Nachman said: For example, I judge financial cases individually. And so said Rabbi Chiya: For example, I judge financial cases individually."

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: כְּגוֹן אֲנָא דִּגְמִירְנָא וּסְבִירְנָא וּנְקִיטְנָא רְשׁוּתָא, אֲבָל לָא נְקִיט רְשׁוּתָא – דִּינֵיהּ לָא דִּינָא? אוֹ דִילְמָא: אַף עַל גַּב דְּלָא נָקֵיט רְשׁוּתָא – דִּינֵיהּ דִּינָא?
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before Such as I, that I have studied and extrapolate and have received permission But has not received permission his judgment is not judgment? Or perhaps even though he did not receive permission his judgment is judgment?
llm_translation: He asked them: For example, I who learn and understand and take possession of an object, but do not take possession of it - is its status not legally binding? Or perhaps, even though I do not take possession of it, its status is legally binding?

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: דְּמָר זוּטְרָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן דָּן דִּינָא וּטְעָה, אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב יוֹסֵף. אָמַר לוֹ: אִם קִיבְּלוּךְ עֲלַיְיהוּ – לָא תְּשַׁלֵּם, וְאִי לָא – זִיל שַׁלֵּים. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: כִּי לָא נָקֵיט רְשׁוּתָא – דִּינֵיהּ דִּינָא. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Come hear Mar Zutra, son of Rav Naḥman, adjudicated case and erred he came before Rav Yosef said to him: If accepted you upon themselves you are not pay But if not go pay learn from it where one did not receive permission his ruling is judgment. Learn from it
llm_translation: Come and hear: Mar Zutra, son of Rav Nachman, judged a case erroneously. He came before Rav Yosef. He said to him: If they accepted your ruling - do not pay, but if not - go and pay. Learn from this: If one does not have authority, his judgments are null. Learn from this.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב: הַאי מַאן דְּבָעֵי לְמֵידַן דִּינָא, וְאִי טְעָה מִיבְעֵי לְמִיפְּטַר – לִישְׁקוֹל רְשׁוּתָא מִבֵּי רֵישׁ גָּלוּתָא. וְכֵן אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: לִשְׁקוֹל רְשׁוּתָא מִבֵּי רֵישׁ גָּלוּתָא.
human_translation: Rav says: One who wants to adjudicate a case and wants to be exempt if he errs must receive permission from the Exilarch And similarly, Shmuel says: he must receive permission from the Exilarch.
llm_translation: Rav said: One who wishes to learn the law, and if he erred, he should be exempt - let him seek permission from the head of the exile. And so said Shmuel: Let him seek permission from the head of the exile.

hebrew_text: פְּשִׁיטָא: מֵהָכָא לְהָכָא, וּמֵהָתָם לְהָתָם – מַהֲנֵי. וּמֵהָכָא לְהָתָם נָמֵי מַהֲנֵי, דְּהָכָא שֵׁבֶט וְהָתָם מְחוֹקֵק.
human_translation: obvious from here to here, and from there to there, is effective. And from here to there, is also effective, since here a scepter, and there a staff,
llm_translation: Interpretation: From here to there, and from there to there - what is the law? And from here to there, to there, it is the same law, for here it is a staff and there it is a measuring line.

hebrew_text: כִּדְתַנְיָא: ״לֹא יָסוּר שֵׁבֶט מִיהוּדָה״ – אֵלּוּ רָאשֵׁי גָלִיּוֹת שֶׁבְּבָבֶל, שֶׁרוֹדִין אֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל בְּשֵׁבֶט. ״וּמְחֹקֵק מִבֵּין רַגְלָיו״ – אֵלּוּ בְּנֵי בָּנָיו שֶׁל הִלֵּל, שֶׁמְּלַמְּדִין תּוֹרָה בָּרַבִּים.
human_translation: as it is taught “The scepter shall not depart from Judah”; these are the Exilarchs in Babylonia, who subjugate the Jewish people with a scepter. “Nor the ruler’s staff from between his feet”; These are the grandchildren of Hillel who teach Torah in public,
llm_translation: As it was taught: "A scepter shall not depart from Judah" - these are the exilarchs in Babylon, who rule over Israel with a scepter. "Nor the ruler's staff from between his feet" - these are the descendants of Hillel, who teach Torah to the public.

hebrew_text: מֵהָתָם לְהָכָא מַאי? תָּא שְׁמַע: דְּרַבָּה בַּר חָנָה דָּן דִּינָא וּטְעָה. אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי חִיָּיא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִי קִיבְּלוּךְ עֲלַיְיהוּ – לָא תְּשַׁלֵּם, וְאִי לָא – זִיל שַׁלֵּים. וְהָא רַבָּה בַּר חָנָה רְשׁוּתָא הֲוָה נְקִיט! שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: מֵהָתָם לְהָכָא לָא מַהֲנֵי. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: from there, to here what Come hear that Rabba bar Ḥana adjudicated a case and erred. He came before Rabbi Ḥiyya said to him: If accepted you upon themselves, you are not pay but if not, go pay. But Rabba bar Ḥana received permission learn from from there to here is not effective. Learn from it
llm_translation: From there to here, what is it? Come and hear: Rabba bar Ḥana judged the case and erred. He came before Rabbi Ḥiyya. He said to him: If they accepted you upon them - do not pay, and if not - go and pay. But Rabba bar Ḥana had authority! Learn from it: From there to here it does not apply. Learn from it.

hebrew_text: וְלָא מַהֲנֵי? וְהָא רַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא, כִּי הֲוָה מִינְּצֵי בַּהֲדֵי דְּבֵי רֵישׁ גָּלוּתָא, אָמַר: לָאו מִינַּיְיכוּ נְקִיטְנָא רְשׁוּתָא, נְקִיטְנָא רְשׁוּתָא מֵאַבָּא מָרִי, וְאַבָּא מָרִי מֵרַב, וְרַב מֵרַבִּי חִיָּיא, וְרַבִּי חִיָּיא מֵרַבִּי! בְּמִילְּתָא דְעָלְמָא הוּא דְּאוֹקֵים לְהוּ.
human_translation: And not effective? But when Rabba bar Rav Huna was in a dispute with the the house of the Exilarch he said: not from you I received permission I received permission from my father, my master, and my father, my master, from Rav, and Rav from Rabbi Ḥiyya, and Rabbi Ḥiyya from Rabbi He was standing up to them with words alone,
llm_translation: And not from there? And Rabba bar Rav Huna, when he was sitting at the entrance of the Exilarch's house, said: We do not take permission from you, we take permission from Abba Mari, and Abba Mari from Rav, and Rav from Rabbi Chiya, and Rabbi Chiya from Rabbi! It is in matters of the world that they establish for them.

hebrew_text: וְכִי מֵאַחַר דְּלָא מַהֲנֵי, רַבָּה בַּר חָנָה רְשׁוּתָא דִּנְקַט לְמָה לִי? לָעֲיָירוֹת הָעוֹמְדִים עַל הַגְּבוּלִין.
human_translation: But since is not effective why did Rabba bar Ḥana receive permission for the cities that stand on the borders
llm_translation: And when since not benefits, Rabba bar Hana, why to me? To the cities standing on the borders.

hebrew_text: מַאי רְשׁוּתָא? כִּי הֲוָה נָחֵית רַבָּה בַּר חָנָה לְבָבֶל, אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי חִיָּיא לְרַבִּי: בֶּן אָחִי יוֹרֵד לְבָבֶל. ״יוֹרֶה?״ ״יוֹרֶה!״, ״יָדִין?״ ״יָדִין!״, ״יַתִּיר בְּכוֹרוֹת?״ ״יַתִּיר!״.
human_translation: What permission? When Rabba bar Ḥana descended to Babylonia, Rabbi Ḥiyya said to Rabbi My brother’s son is descending to Babylonia. May he teach He may teach. May he adjudicate He may adjudicate. May he declare a firstborn permitted? He may declare permitted.
llm_translation: What is the permission? When Rabba bar Ḥana was descending to Babylon, Rabbi Ḥiyya said to Rabbi: "My brother's son is descending to Babylon." "He descends?" "He descends!" "He judges?" "He judges!" "He permits firstborn animals?" "He permits!"

hebrew_text: כִּי הֲוָה נָחֵית רַב לְבָבֶל, אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי חִיָּיא לְרַבִּי: בֶּן אֲחוֹתִי יוֹרֵד לְבָבֶל. ״יוֹרֶה?״ ״יוֹרֶה!״, ״יָדִין?״ ״יָדִין!״, ״יַתִּיר בְּכוֹרוֹת?״ ״אַל יַתִּיר!״.
human_translation: when Rav, descended to Babylonia, Rabbi Ḥiyya said to Rabbi My sister’s son is descending to Babylonia. May he teach He may teach. May he adjudicate He may adjudicate. May he declare a firstborn permitted? He may not declare permitted.
llm_translation: When Rav descended to Babylon, Rabbi Chiya said to Rabbi: "My nephew is descending to Babylon." "Descending?" "Descending!" "Judging?" "Judging!" "Permitting firstborn animals?" "He should not permit!"

hebrew_text: מַאי שְׁנָא לְמָר דְּקָא קָרֵי ״בֶּן אָחִי״, וּמַאי שְׁנָא לְמָר דְּקָא קָרֵי ״בֶּן אֲחוֹתִי״? וְכִי תֵּימָא הָכִי הֲוָה מַעֲשֶׂה, וְהָאָמַר מָר: אַיְּבוּ וְחַנָּה וְשֵׁילָא וּמָרְתָא וְרַבִּי חִיָּיא כּוּלְּהוּ בְּנֵי אַבָּא בַּר אַחָא כַּרְסַלָּא מִכַּפְרִי הֲווֹ? רַב בַּר אֲחוּהּ דַּהֲוָה בַּר אֲחָתֵיהּ, רַבָּה בַּר חָנָה בַּר אֲחוּהּ דְּלָאו בַּר אֲחָתֵיהּ.
human_translation: What is different concerning this Sage, that called him: My brother’s son, and what is different concerning that Sage, that called him: My sister’s son? And if you would say that this was situation: but doesn’t the Master say: Aivu, and Ḥana, and Sheila, and Marta, and Rabbi Ḥiyya, were all sons of Abba bar Aḥa Karsala from Kafrei? Rav his brother’s son who was his sister’s son, Rabba bar Ḥana was his brother’s son who was not his sister’s son.
llm_translation: What is the difference for the Master that he reads "ben achi" (son of my brother), and what is the difference for the Master that he reads "ben achoti" (son of my sister)? And if you will say that this was the case, and the Master said: Aivu, Channa, Sheila, Marta, and Rabbi Chiya - were they all sons of the father of Bar Acha from Kapri? Rav bar Achuha, who was the son of her sister, and Rabba bar Chana, who was the son of her brother but not the son of her sister.

hebrew_text: וְאִי בָּעֵית אֵימָא:
human_translation: And if you wish, say
llm_translation: And if you will say, I will say:

hebrew_text: עַל שֵׁם חׇכְמָתוֹ, דִּכְתִיב: ״אֱמֹר לַחׇכְמָה אֲחֹתִי אָתְּ״.
human_translation: due to his wisdom, as it is written: “Say to wisdom: You are my sister”
llm_translation: Regarding the name of His wisdom, as it is written: "Say to wisdom, 'You are my sister.'"

hebrew_text: יַתִּיר בְּכוֹרוֹת? אַל יַתִּיר. מַאי טַעְמָא? אִילֵּימָא מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא חַכִּים, הָא קָא אָמְרִינַן דְּחַכִּים טוּבָא! אֶלָּא מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא בְּקִיעַ בְּמוּמֵי.
human_translation: declare a firstborn permitted, He may not declare permitted. What is the reason If we say because was not wise but we said that he was exceedingly wise. Rather, because, he was not an expert with regard to blemishes,
llm_translation: Extra firstborns? Do not be extra. What is the reason? If you say it is because they are not wise, but don't we say that the wise are good! Rather, it is because they have a blemish.

hebrew_text: וְהָאָמַר רַב: שְׁמוֹנָה עָשָׂר חֳדָשִׁים גָּדַלְתִּי אֵצֶל רוֹעֵה בְהֵמָה, לֵידַע אֵיזֶה מוּם קָבוּעַ וְאֵיזֶה מוּם עוֹבֵר? אֶלָּא, לְחַלֵּק לוֹ כָּבוֹד לְרַבָּה בַּר חָנָה.
human_translation: But didn’t Rav say: I apprenticed with a shepherd eighteen months to know which a permanent blemish, and which a temporary blemish? Rather, to bestow honor upon Rabba bar Ḥana.
llm_translation: And he said, Rav: "Eighteen months I have grown by a livestock herder, to know which blemish is permanent and which blemish is temporary? Rather, to give honor to Rabba bar Chana."

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: מִשּׁוּם הָא גּוּפֵיהּ, דְּרַב בְּקִיעַ בְּמוּמֵי טְפֵי, וְשָׁרֵי מוּמֵי דְּלָא יָדְעִי אִינָשֵׁי. וְאָמְרִי: ״כִּי הַאי גַוְונָא שְׁרָא רַב״, וְאָתוּ לְמִשְׁרֵי מוּם עוֹבֵר.
human_translation: And if you wish, say It is due to this itself: Since Rav was a great expert with regard to blemishes, he permit blemishes people do not know about. And they would say a case like this Rav declared permitted, and they would come to permit a temporary blemish,
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: Because of this, the body, for Rav is particular about blemishes of the hands, and he permits blemishes that people do not know. And they said: "For this type Rav permits," and they came to permit a hidden blemish.

hebrew_text: יוֹרֶה, יוֹרֶה. אִי גְּמִיר, רְשׁוּתָא לְמָה לִי לְמִישְׁקַל? מִשּׁוּם מַעֲשֶׂה שֶׁהָיָה.
human_translation: May he teach He may teach. If he had studied why do I to receive permission? due to an incident that took place.
llm_translation: Teacher, teacher. If you have learned, why do I need to be taught? Because of an incident that occurred.

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: פַּעַם אַחַת הָלַךְ רַבִּי לְמָקוֹם אֶחָד, וְרָאָה בְּנֵי אָדָם שֶׁמְּגַבְּלִין עִיסּוֹתֵיהֶם בְּטוּמְאָה. אָמַר לָהֶם: מִפְּנֵי מָה אַתֶּם מְגַבְּלִין עִיסּוֹתֵיכֶם בְּטוּמְאָה? אָמְרוּ לוֹ: תַּלְמִיד אֶחָד בָּא לְכָאן וְהוֹרָה לָנוּ: מֵי בְצָעִים אֵין מַכְשִׁירִין. וְהוּא מֵי בֵיצִים דְּרַשׁ לְהוּ, וְאִינְהוּ סְבוּר מֵי בְצָעִים קָאָמַר.
human_translation: As it is taught Rabbi once went to a certain place, and he saw people kneading dough in impurity, said to them: For what are you kneading your dough in impurity? They said to him: A certain Torah scholar came here and taught us water swamps [ mei betza’im ] does not render susceptible But he taught them water of eggs [ mei beitzim ], But they thought he said: Water swamps.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: One time Rabbi went to a certain place and saw people who were kneading their dough in a state of impurity. He said to them: "Why do you knead your dough in a state of impurity?" They replied to him: "One student came here and taught us that water of pits is not valid. And he interpreted it as water of eggs, but he thought it was water of pits."

hebrew_text: וְטָעוּ נָמֵי בְּהָא: מֵי קֵרַמְיוֹן וּמֵי פֵיגָה פְּסוּלִין, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהֵן מֵי בְצָעִים. וְאִינְהוּ סְבוּר: מִדִּלְגַבֵּי חַטָּאת פְּסִילִי – אַכְשׁוֹרֵי נָמֵי לָא מַכְשְׁרִי. וְלָא הִיא: הָתָם, לְעִנְיַן חַטָּאת, בָּעֵינַן מַיִם חַיִּים; הָכָא, אַכְשׁוֹרֵי כָּל דְּהוּ מַכְשְׁרִי.
human_translation: And erred also with regard to this: The waters of Keramiyyon and the waters of Piga are not fit since they are water swamps. And they thought: Since is not fit water of purification, it also does not render susceptible But it is not so, there, with regard to purification, we need: “Running water” here, rendering susceptible any renders susceptible.
llm_translation: And they erred in this: water of Karmiyon and water of Peigah are invalid, because they are waters of swamps. And they thought: since regarding sin offerings, invalid waters do not disqualify, they should also be valid here. But it is not so: there, for the matter of a sin offering, living waters are required; here, any valid waters are valid.

hebrew_text: תָּנָא, בְּאוֹתָהּ שָׁעָה גָּזְרוּ: תַּלְמִיד אַל יוֹרֶה אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן נוֹטֵל רְשׁוּת מֵרַבּוֹ.
human_translation: It was taught: At that time, decreed: A Torah scholar may not teach unless he receives permission from his teacher
llm_translation: It was taught: At that moment they decreed: A student should not teach unless he has received permission from his teacher.

hebrew_text: תַּנְחוּם בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי אַמֵּי אִיקְּלַע לְחֶתֶר. דְּרַשׁ לְהוּ: מוּתָּר לִלְתּוֹת חִיטִּין בַּפֶּסַח. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: לָאו רַבִּי מַנִּי דְּמִן צוּר אִיכָּא הָכָא? וְתַנְיָא: תַּלְמִיד אַל יוֹרֶה הֲלָכָה בִּמְקוֹם רַבּוֹ, אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן הָיָה רָחוֹק מִמֶּנּוּ שָׁלֹשׁ פַּרְסָאוֹת כְּנֶגֶד מַחֲנֵה יִשְׂרָאֵל. אָמַר לְהוּ: לָאו אַדַּעְתַּאי.
human_translation: Tanḥum, son of Rabbi Ami, arrived Ḥatar, he taught them: It is permitted to wash wheat on Passover, They said to him: Isn’t Rabbi Mani from Tyre here And it is taught A Torah scholar may not teach in the vicinity of his teacher, unless he is distant from three parasangs [ parsaot ], corresponding to the camp of Israel. said to them: It did not enter my mind
llm_translation: Tanhum, son of Rabbi Ammi, entered a village. He taught them: "It is permitted to grind wheat on Passover." They said to him: "Is it not Rabbi Mani who is from Tzur here?" And it was taught: "A student should not teach halakha in the presence of his teacher, unless he is three parasangs away, opposite the camp of Israel." He said to them: "I do not know."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי חִיָּיא חַזְיֵיהּ לְהָהוּא גַּבְרָא דַּהֲוָה קָאֵי בְּבֵית הַקְּבָרוֹת. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָאו בֶּן אִישׁ פְּלוֹנִי כֹּהֵן אַתָּה? אָמַר לֵיהּ: אִין. אֲבוּהּ דְּהָהוּא גַּבְרָא גְּבַהּ עֵינַיִם הֲוָה, נָתַן עֵינָיו בִּגְרוּשָׁה וְחִילְּלוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya saw a certain man standing in a cemetery. He said to him: Are you not the son of so-and-so priest? said to him: Yes, that man’s, father was with raised eyes He set his eyes upon a divorcée and disqualified
llm_translation: Rabbi Chiya saw that man who was standing in the cemetery. He said to him: Are you not the son of so-and-so the priest? He said to him: No. The father of that man had lofty eyes, he cast his eyes upon a divorced woman and defiled her.

hebrew_text: פְּשִׁיטָא, לְפַלְגָא – הָא קָאָמַר דְּמַהֲנֵי. עַל תְּנַאי מַאי? תָּא שְׁמַע, דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן לְרַב שֶׁמֶן: הֲרֵי אַתָּה בִּרְשׁוּתֵנוּ עַד שֶׁתָּבֹא אֶצְלֵנוּ.
human_translation: obvious partial it has been said that effective. what conditionally? Come hear Rabbi Yoḥanan said to Rav Shemen: You have our permission until you return to us.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Peshita, le'palga - ha ka'amar de'mahanei. Al tenai mai? Ta shema, da'amar lei Rabbi Yochanan le'Rav Shemen: harei atah birshutenu ad shetavo etzleneu. English translation: It is obvious, to half - this is what he is saying that it is. According to whose opinion? Come and hear, for Rabbi Yochanan said to Rav Shemen: "You are in our domain until you come to us."

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא, אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: שְׁנַיִם שֶׁדָּנוּ – דִּינֵיהֶם דִּין, אֶלָּא שֶׁנִּקְרָא בֵּית דִּין חָצוּף. יָתֵיב רַב נַחְמָן וְקָאָמַר לְהָא שְׁמַעְתָּא. אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רָבָא לְרַב נַחְמָן: אֲפִילּוּ שְׁנַיִם מְזַכִּין אוֹ שְׁנַיִם מְחַיְּיבִין וְאֶחָד אוֹמֵר אֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ – יוֹסִיפוּ הַדַּיָּינִין. וְאִי אִיתָא, לִהְווֹ כִּשְׁנַיִם שֶׁדָּנוּ!
human_translation: the itself, Shmuel says: two who adjudicated their judgment is judgment, but they are called an impudent court. Rav Naḥman sat and said this halakha . Rava raised an objection to Rav Naḥman even two deem exempt or two deem liable and one says: I do not know, the judges must add And if it is so they should be as two who adjudicated
llm_translation: The body, Samuel said: Two who judged - their judgment is a judgment, except that it is called a presumptuous court. Rav Nahman was sitting and saying this teaching. Rava raised an objection to Rav Nahman: Even if two acquit or two obligate and one says, "I do not know" - the judges should increase. And if it is so, they should be like two who judged!

hebrew_text: שָׁאנֵי הָתָם, דְּמֵעִיקָּרָא אַדַּעְתָּא דִּתְלָתָא יְתִיבִי. הָכָא, לָאו אַדַּעְתָּא דִּתְלָתָא יְתֵיבִי.
human_translation: It is different there, as they convened from the outset with the knowledge that they are three here they did not convene with the knowledge that they are three,
llm_translation: There, the difference is that the primary knowledge of three sits. Here, not the primary knowledge of three sits.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ, רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: הַדִּין בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה, וּפְשָׁרָה בִּשְׁנַיִם. וְיָפֶה כֹּחַ פְּשָׁרָה מִכֹּחַ הַדִּין, שֶׁשְּׁנַיִם שֶׁדָּנוּ – בַּעֲלֵי דִינִין יְכוֹלִין לַחֲזוֹר בָּהֶן, וּשְׁנַיִם שֶׁעָשׂוּ פְּשָׁרָה – אֵין בַּעֲלֵי דִינִין יְכוֹלִין לַחֲזוֹר בָּהֶן.
human_translation: raised an objection to Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: law by three and compromise by two And the power of compromise is greater than the power of adjudication, as two adjudicated the litigants are able to withdraw But two a compromise, the litigants may not withdraw.
llm_translation: He raised an objection against him: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Judgment with three, and compromise with two. And the power of compromise is greater than the power of judgment, for two who judged - the judges can retract, and two who made a compromise - the judges cannot retract.

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא: פְּלִיגִי רַבָּנַן עֲלֵיהּ דְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: שְׁנַיִם שֶׁדָּנוּ – לְדִבְרֵי הַכֹּל אֵין דִּינֵיהֶם דִּין! גַּבְרָא אַגַּבְרָא קָא רָמֵית?
human_translation: And if you would say the Rabbis disagree with Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel but doesn’t Rabbi Abbahu say: two that adjudicated monetary law everyone agrees their judgment is not judgment, Are you setting man against man?
llm_translation: And if you will say: Do the Rabbis disagree with regard to the ruling of Rabbi Shimon ben Gamliel, and didn't Rabbi Abahu say: "Two who judged - according to everyone, their judgment is not a judgment!" Is a man lifting up against a man?

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא, אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: שְׁנַיִם שֶׁדָּנוּ דִּינֵי מָמוֹנוֹת – לְדִבְרֵי הַכֹּל אֵין דִּינֵיהֶם דִּין. אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רַבִּי אַבָּא לְרַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: דָּן אֶת הַדִּין וְזִיכָּה אֶת הַחַיָּיב, וְחִיֵּיב אֶת הַזַּכַּאי, טִימֵּא אֶת הַטָּהוֹר, טִיהֵר אֶת הַטָּמֵא – מַה שֶּׁעָשָׂה עָשׂוּי, וּמְשַׁלֵּם מִבֵּיתוֹ.
human_translation: the itself: Rabbi Abbahu says: two that adjudicated monetary law everyone agrees their judgment is not judgment. Rabbi Abba raised an objection to Rabbi Abbahu adjudicated law and exonerated the liable, or deemed liable the exempt, deemed impure that which is pure, deemed pure that which is impure, what he did is done, And pays from his house,
llm_translation: The body, Rabbi Avahu said: Two who judged monetary cases - according to everyone, their judgment is not a judgment. Rabbi Abba raised an objection to Rabbi Avahu: He judges the judgment and acquits the liable, and obligates the innocent, declares impure the pure, declares pure the impure - what he did is done, and he pays from his own property.

hebrew_text: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן? דְּקַיבְּלוּהוּ עֲלַיְיהוּ. אִי הָכִי, אַמַּאי מְשַׁלֵּם מִבֵּיתוֹ? דְּאָמְרוּ לֵיהּ: דָּיְינַתְּ לַן דִּין תּוֹרָה.
human_translation: Here we are dealing with which accepted upon themselves, If so, why pay from his house? because they said to him: Adjudicate for us Torah law.
llm_translation: Here we are dealing with what? That they accepted it upon themselves. If so, why does he pay from his own house? Because they said to him: "We are satisfied with the judgment of the Torah."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב סָפְרָא לְרַבִּי אַבָּא: דִּטְעָה בְּמַאי? אִילֵימָא דִּטְעָה בִּדְבַר מִשְׁנָה, וְהָאָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת אָמַר רַבִּי אַמֵּי: טָעָה בִּדְבַר מִשְׁנָה חוֹזֵר? אֶלָּא דִּטְעָה בְּשִׁיקּוּל הַדַּעַת.
human_translation: Rav Safra said to Rabbi Abba: when erred in what If we say that erred in a matter Mishna, But doesn’t Rav Sheshet say Rabbi Ami says: erred in a matter Mishna, revoked Rather, where erred in deliberation.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Safra to Rabbi Abba: "He erred in what?" If you say he erred in a matter of Mishnah, but didn't Rav Sheshet say in the name of Rabbi Ammi: "If one erred in a matter of Mishnah, he should retract?" Rather, he erred in weighing the matter.

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי דָּמֵי בְּשִׁיקּוּל הַדַּעַת? אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: כְּגוֹן תְּרֵי תַנָּאֵי וּתְרֵי אָמוֹרָאֵי דִּפְלִיגִי אַהֲדָדֵי, וְלָא אִיתְּמַר הִלְכְתָא לָא כְּמָר וְלָא כְּמָר, וְסוּגְיַין דְּעָלְמָא אַלִּיבָּא דְּחַד מִינַּיְיהוּ, וַאֲזַל אִיהוּ וַעֲבַד כְּאִידַּךְ – הַיְינוּ שִׁיקּוּל הַדַּעַת.
human_translation: What are the circumstances in deliberation? Rav Pappa said: for example, two tanna’im or two amora’im who disagree with one another, and the halakha was not stated with Sage or with Sage; and the standard practice in accordance with one of them, and he went and executed in accordance with the other this is deliberation.
llm_translation: How are the criteria for weighing knowledge? Rav Papa said: For example, two Tannaim and two Amoraim who argue with each other, and the halacha is not established like this one or like that one, and the general custom in the world is not in accordance with one of them, and he goes and acts like the other - that is weighing knowledge.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא כְּתַנָּאֵי: בִּיצּוּעַ בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: פְּשָׁרָה בְּיָחִיד. סַבְרוּהָ, לְכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא מַקְּשִׁינַן פְּשָׁרָה לְדִין.
human_translation: Let us say is parallel to tanna’im , Mediation by three the statement of Rabbi Meir. And the Rabbis say: Compromise by a single assumed everyone we compare compromise to judgment,
llm_translation: Let us say according to the Tannaim: In the case of a miscarriage in three, these are the words of Rabbi Meir. And the Sages say: Interpretation in the case of an individual. They hold that we interpret it for everyone in the world according to the law.

hebrew_text: מַאי לָאו בְּהָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי, דְּמָר סָבַר: דִּין בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה, וּמָר סָבַר: דִּין בִּשְׁנַיִם? לָא, דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא דִּין בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה, וְהָכָא בְּהָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי: דְּמָר סָבַר מַקְּשִׁינַן פְּשָׁרָה לְדִין, וּמָר סָבַר לָא מַקְּשִׁינַן פְּשָׁרָה לְדִין.
human_translation: What, is it not they disagree in this that Sage, holds judgment by three and Sage, holds judgment by two No, that everyone judgment by three and here, they disagree with regard to this Sage, holds we compare compromise to judgment, and Sage, holds we do not compare compromise to judgment.
llm_translation: What is the reason why they do not argue about this? Because one Master holds: judgment with three, and the other Master holds: judgment with two? No, for the whole world holds judgment with three, and here they argue about this: one Master holds that we make a compromise for judgment, and the other Master holds that we do not make a compromise for judgment.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא: תְּלָתָא תַּנָּאֵי בִּפְשָׁרָה, דְּמָר סָבַר בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה, וּמָר סָבַר בִּשְׁנַיִם, וּמָר סָבַר בְּיָחִיד. אָמַר רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִיקָא, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַבִּי יֵימַר בַּר שֶׁלֶמְיָא: מַאן דְּאָמַר תְּרֵי – אֲפִילּוּ חַד נָמֵי, וְהַאי דְּקָאָמַר תְּרֵי – כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלִיהְווֹ עֲלֵיהּ סָהֲדִי.
human_translation: Let say three tanna’im with regard to compromise, as Sage, holds by three and Sage, holds by two and Sage, holds by a single Rav Aḥa, son of Rav Ika, and some say Rabbi Yeimar bar Shelamya, said: The one who says two even one. And that he says two that there would be witnesses to
llm_translation: Let's say: Three teachings in the straightforward interpretation, as one Sage holds by three, and one Sage holds by two, and one Sage holds by one. Rav Acha, son of Rav Ika, said, and some say it was Rabbi Yeymar, son of Shelemya: The one who says two – even if it is one, and the one who says two – how can there be witnesses against him.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ פְּשָׁרָה אֵינָהּ צְרִיכָה קִנְיָן, דְּאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ צְרִיכָה קִנְיָן, לְמַאן דְּאָמַר צְרִיכָה – תְּלָתָא לְמָה לִי? תִּסְגֵּי בִּתְרֵי וְלִיקְנֵי מִינֵּיהּ! וְהִלְכְתָא: פְּשָׁרָה צְרִיכָה קִנְיָן.
human_translation: Rav Ashi says: Learn from compromise does not require acquisition, As if it enters your mind requires acquisition according to the one who says requires why do I three Let it suffice with two and let perform an act of acquisition with But the halakha a compromise requires acquisition
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said: Hear from it, inference it does not require acquisition, for if according to your opinion it requires acquisition, according to whom does it require? Three, why do I need? Go and acquire from it! And the halakha is: Inference requires acquisition.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁהַדִּין בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה, כָּךְ בִּיצּוּעַ בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה.
human_translation: The Sages taught Just as judgment by three so mediation by three
llm_translation: The Sages taught: Just as judgment requires three, so too does acquittal require three.
