hebrew_text: נִגְמַר הַדִּין, אִי אַתָּה רַשַּׁאי לִבְצוֹעַ.
human_translation: the judgment has been issued, is not permitted you to mediate
llm_translation: The judgment is concluded, are you not authorized to cut.

hebrew_text: סרמ״ש בנק״ש סִימָן. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בְּנוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי אוֹמֵר: אָסוּר לִבְצוֹעַ, וְכׇל הַבּוֹצֵעַ – הֲרֵי זֶה חוֹטֵא, וְכׇל הַמְבָרֵךְ אֶת הַבּוֹצֵעַ – הֲרֵי זֶה מְנָאֵץ. וְעַל זֶה נֶאֱמַר: ״בֹּצֵעַ בֵּרֵךְ נִאֵץ ה׳״.
human_translation: a mnemonic Samekh , reish , mem , shin ; beit , nun , kuf , shin . Rabbi Eliezer, son of Rabbi Yosei HaGelili, says: prohibited to mediate and anyone who mediates [ habotze’a ] is a sinner; and anyone who blesses the mediator is cursing And of this, it is stated: the covetous [ botze’a ] blesses himself, though he despises the Lord”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Sarm"sh b'nq"sh siman. Rabbi Eliezer b'no shel Rabbi Yosei HaGalili omer: Asur li'vzoa, v'kol ha'bozea – harei zeh chotei, v'kol ha'mevarech et ha'bozea – harei zeh menaetz. Ve'al zeh ne'emar: "Bozea berech niaetz Hashem." English translation: Sarm"sh b'nq"sh is a sign. Rabbi Eliezer, son of Rabbi Yosei the Galilean, says: It is forbidden to cut off, and anyone who cuts off – behold, he sins, and anyone who blesses the one who cuts off – behold, he is contemptuous. And regarding this it is said: "He who blesses the cutter off, the Lord will hold him in contempt."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא יִקּוֹב הַדִּין אֶת הָהָר, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי הַמִּשְׁפָּט לֵאלֹהִים הוּא״. וְכֵן מֹשֶׁה הָיָה אוֹמֵר: יִקּוֹב הַדִּין אֶת הָהָר. אֲבָל אַהֲרֹן אוֹהֵב שָׁלוֹם וְרוֹדֵף שָׁלוֹם, וּמֵשִׂים שָׁלוֹם בֵּין אָדָם לַחֲבֵירוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״תּוֹרַת אֱמֶת הָיְתָה בְּפִיהוּ וְעַוְלָה לֹא נִמְצָא בִשְׂפָתָיו בְּשָׁלוֹם וּבְמִישׁוֹר הָלַךְ אִתִּי וְרַבִּים הֵשִׁיב מֵעָוֹן״.
human_translation: Rather, the judgment will pierce the mountain, as it is stated: “For the judgment is God’s” And similarly, Moses would say: Let the judgment pierce the mountain. But Aaron, a lover of peace and a pursuer of peace, and would apply peace between person and the other, as it is stated: “The law of truth was in his mouth, and unrighteousness was not found in his lips; he walked with Me in peace and uprightness, and turned many away from iniquity”
llm_translation: The judgment should pierce the mountain, as it is stated: "For the judgment is God's." And so Moses used to say: The judgment should pierce the mountain. But Aaron loved peace and pursued peace, and he would bring peace between a man and his fellow, as it is stated: "The teaching of truth was in his mouth, and injustice was not found on his lips; in peace and uprightness he walked with Me, and he turned many away from iniquity."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: הֲרֵי שֶׁגָּזַל סְאָה שֶׁל חִטִּים, וּטְחָנָהּ וַאֲפָאָהּ וְהִפְרִישׁ מִמֶּנָּה חַלָּה, כֵּיצַד מְבָרֵךְ? אֵין זֶה מְבָרֵךְ אֶלָּא מְנָאֵץ. וְעַל זֶה נֶאֱמַר: ״וּבֹצֵעַ בֵּרֵךְ נִאֵץ ה׳״.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: one stole a se’a of wheat and ground it and baked it and separated ḥalla from it, how can he recite the blessing He is not blessing; rather, cursing And of this it is stated: “And the covetous [ uvotze’a ] blesses himself, though he despises the Lord,”
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: If one stole a se'ah of wheat, ground it, kneaded it, baked it, and separated challah from it, how does one make a blessing? This is not making a blessing, but rather mocking. And regarding this it is said: "He who mocks the poor insults his Maker."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: לֹא נֶאֱמַר ״בּוֹצֵעַ״ אֶלָּא כְּנֶגֶד יְהוּדָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיֹּאמֶר יְהוּדָה אֶל אֶחָיו מַה בֶּצַע כִּי נַהֲרֹג אֶת אָחִינוּ״. וְכׇל הַמְבָרֵךְ אֶת יְהוּדָה – הֲרֵי זֶה מְנָאֵץ, וְעַל זֶה נֶאֱמַר: ״וּבֹצֵעַ בֵּרֵךְ נִאֵץ ה׳״.
human_translation: Rabbi Meir says: botze’a was stated only with regard to Judah, as it is stated: “And Judah said to his brothers: What profit [ betza ] is it if we slay our brother And anyone who blesses Judah is cursing and of this it is stated: “And the covetous [ uvotze’a ] blesses himself, though he despises the Lord,”
llm_translation: Rabbi Meir says: It is not stated "Bozea" except corresponding to Judah, as it is stated: "And Judah said to his brothers, 'What profit is it if we kill our brother?'" And anyone who curses Judah - behold, this one is contemptuous, and regarding this it is said: "He who blesses Bozea, the Lord will curse."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן קׇרְחָה אוֹמֵר: מִצְוָה לִבְצוֹעַ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אֱמֶת וּמִשְׁפַּט שָׁלוֹם שִׁפְטוּ בְּשַׁעֲרֵיכֶם״. וַהֲלֹא בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁיֵּשׁ מִשְׁפָּט – אֵין שָׁלוֹם, וּבִמְקוֹם שֶׁיֵּשׁ שָׁלוֹם – אֵין מִשְׁפָּט? אֶלָּא אֵיזֶהוּ מִשְׁפָּט שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ שָׁלוֹם? הֱוֵי אוֹמֵר: זֶה בִּיצּוּעַ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korḥa says: a mitzva to mediate as it is stated: “Execute the judgment of truth and peace in your gates” Is it not that in the place where there is judgment there is no peace, and in a place where there is peace, there is no judgment? Rather, which is the judgment that has peace within it? You must say: This is mediation,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korcha says: It is a commandment to cut, as it is stated: "Execute the judgment of truth and peace in your gates." But is it not the case that where there is judgment, there is no peace, and where there is peace, there is no judgment? Rather, what judgment is there that includes peace? Say: this is referring to cutting.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן בְּדָוִד הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״וַיְהִי דָוִד עֹשֶׂה מִשְׁפָּט וּצְדָקָה״. וַהֲלֹא כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁיֵּשׁ מִשְׁפָּט – אֵין צְדָקָה, וּצְדָקָה – אֵין מִשְׁפָּט? אֶלָּא אֵיזֶהוּ מִשְׁפָּט שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ צְדָקָה? הֱוֵי אוֹמֵר: זֶה בִּיצּוּעַ.
human_translation: And similarly, with regard to David, it says: “And David executed justice and charity And is it not wherever there is justice, there is no charity, and charity, there is no justice? Rather, which is the justice that has within it charity? You must say: This is mediation.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And so in David he says: "And David did what is just and right." But is it not the case that wherever there is justice, there is no righteousness, and where there is righteousness, there is no justice? Rather, what kind of justice includes righteousness? Say: this is in almsgiving.

hebrew_text: אֲתָאן לְתַנָּא קַמָּא. דָּן אֶת הַדִּין, זִיכָּה אֶת הַזַּכַּאי וְחִיֵּיב אֶת הַחַיָּיב. וְרָאָה שֶׁנִּתְחַיֵּיב עָנִי מָמוֹן, וְשִׁלֵּם לוֹ מִתּוֹךְ בֵּיתוֹ – זֶה מִשְׁפָּט וּצְדָקָה.
human_translation: we come to the first tanna , adjudicated law, exonerated the exempt and deemed liable the liable saw that a poor person became liable money and paid for him from his house, this is justice and charity.
llm_translation: He came before the first Tanna. He judged the case, acquitted the innocent, and found the guilty liable. And if he saw that a poor person was owed money, and he paid him from his own funds - this is justice and righteousness.

hebrew_text: מִשְׁפָּט לָזֶה וּצְדָקָה לָזֶה: מִשְׁפָּט לָזֶה – שֶׁהֶחְזִיר לוֹ מָמוֹן, וּצְדָקָה לָזֶה – שֶׁשִּׁילֵּם לוֹ מִתּוֹךְ בֵּיתוֹ. וְכֵן בְּדָוִד הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״וַיְהִי דָוִד עֹשֶׂה מִשְׁפָּט וּצְדָקָה לְכׇל עַמּוֹ״. מִשְׁפָּט לָזֶה – שֶׁהֶחְזִיר לוֹ אֶת מָמוֹנוֹ, וּצְדָקָה לָזֶה – שֶׁשִּׁילֵּם לוֹ מִתּוֹךְ בֵּיתוֹ.
human_translation: justice for this and charity for that justice for this because restored money to him; and charity for that because paid for him from his house. And similarly, with regard to David, it says: “And David executed justice and charity to all his people” justice for this because restored his money to him, and charity for that because paid for him from his house.
llm_translation: Judgment for this and righteousness for this: Judgment for this - that he returned his money to him, and righteousness for this - that he paid him from within his house. And so too in David it says: "And David administered judgment and righteousness for all his people." Judgment for this - that he returned his money to him, and righteousness for this - that he paid him from within his house.

hebrew_text: קַשְׁיָא לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי: הַאי ״לְכׇל עַמּוֹ״ – לַעֲנִיִּים מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ! אֶלָּא, רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁלֹּא שִׁילֵּם מִתּוֹךְ בֵּיתוֹ, זֶהוּ מִשְׁפָּט וּצְדָקָה. מִשְׁפָּט לָזֶה וּצְדָקָה לָזֶה: מִשְׁפָּט לָזֶה – שֶׁהֶחְזִיר לוֹ מָמוֹנוֹ, וּצְדָקָה לָזֶה – שֶׁהוֹצִיא גְּזֵילָה מִתַּחַת יָדוֹ.
human_translation: difficult for Rabbi this “To all his people,” it should have to the poor people. Rather, Rabbi says: Although did not pay from his house, it is justice and charity. justice for this and charity for that justice for this because restored his money to him, and charity for that because removed stolen item from his possession.
llm_translation: A question was raised to Rabbi: This "for all his people" - does it require for the poor? Rather, Rabbi says: Even though he did not pay from his own property, this is justice and righteousness. Justice for this one and righteousness for this one: Justice for this one - that he returned his money to him, and righteousness for this one - that he removed stolen property from under his control.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן מְנַסְיָא אוֹמֵר: שְׁנַיִם שֶׁבָּאוּ לְפָנֶיךָ לַדִּין, עַד שֶׁלֹּא תִּשְׁמַע דִּבְרֵיהֶן, אוֹ מִשֶּׁתִּשְׁמַע דִּבְרֵיהֶן וְאִי אַתָּה יוֹדֵעַ לְהֵיכָן דִּין נוֹטֶה – אַתָּה רַשַּׁאי לוֹמַר לָהֶן: ״צְאוּ וּבִצְעוּ״. מִשֶּׁתִּשְׁמַע דִּבְרֵיהֶן וְאַתָּה יוֹדֵעַ לְהֵיכָן הַדִּין נוֹטֶה – אִי אַתָּה רַשַּׁאי לוֹמַר לָהֶן: ״צְאוּ וּבִצְעוּ״, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״פּוֹטֵר מַיִם רֵאשִׁית מָדוֹן וְלִפְנֵי הִתְגַּלַּע הָרִיב נְטוֹשׁ״. קוֹדֶם שֶׁנִּתְגַּלַּע הָרִיב – אַתָּה יָכוֹל לְנׇטְשׁוֹ; מִשֶּׁנִּתְגַּלַּע הָרִיב – אִי אַתָּה יָכוֹל לְנׇטְשׁוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Menasya says: two come before you for a judgment, before you hear their statements or after you hear their statements but you do not know where the judgment is leaning, you permitted to say to them: Go out and mediate. after you hear their statements and you know where the judgment is leaning, you are not permitted to say to them: Go out and mediate, as it is stated: “The beginning of strife is as when one releases water; therefore leave off contention before the quarrel breaks out” Before the contention is revealed, you can cast it off. Once the contention is revealed, you cannot cast it off.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Menasya says: Two who come before you for judgment, until you hear their words, or once you have heard their words and you do not know where the judgment leans - you are permitted to say to them, "Go out and settle." Once you have heard their words and you know where the judgment leans - you are not permitted to say to them, "Go out and settle," as it is stated: "He who lets out water first is the beginning of strife, and before the quarrel breaks out, abandon it." Before the quarrel breaks out - you can abandon it; once the quarrel breaks out - you cannot abandon it.

hebrew_text: וְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר: שְׁנַיִם שֶׁבָּאוּ לַדִּין, אֶחָד רַךְ וְאֶחָד קָשֶׁה, עַד שֶׁלֹּא תִּשְׁמַע דִּבְרֵיהֶם, אוֹ מִשֶּׁתִּשְׁמַע דִּבְרֵיהֶן וְאֵין אַתָּה יוֹדֵעַ לְהֵיכָן דִּין נוֹטֶה – אַתָּה רַשַּׁאי לוֹמַר לָהֶם: ״אֵין אֲנִי נִזְקָק לָכֶם״, שֶׁמָּא נִתְחַיֵּיב חָזָק וְנִמְצָא חָזָק רוֹדְפוֹ. מִשֶּׁתִּשְׁמַע דִּבְרֵיהֶן וְאַתָּה יוֹדֵעַ לְהֵיכָן הַדִּין נוֹטֶה – אִי אַתָּה יָכוֹל לוֹמַר לָהֶן: ״אֵינִי נִזְקָק לָכֶם״, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לֹא תָגוּרוּ מִפְּנֵי אִישׁ״.
human_translation: And Reish Lakish says: two come for a judgment, one flexible and one rigid before you hear their statements, or after you hear their statements but you do not know where the judgment is leaning, is permitted you to say to them: I will not submit to you. perhaps the strong be liable, and turn out the strong pursue him. once you hear their statements and you know where the judgment is leaning, you may not say to them: I will not submit to you, as it is stated: “You shall not be afraid before any man”
llm_translation: Reish Lakish said: Two people who come to court, one soft and one harsh, until you hear their words, or when you hear their words and you do not know where the judgment leans - you are allowed to say to them: "I do not need you," lest a strong obligation be incurred and a strong pursuer be found. When you hear their words and you know where the judgment leans - if you are able to say to them: "I do not need you," as it is said: "Do not show favoritism in judgment."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן קׇרְחָה אוֹמֵר: מִנַּיִין לְתַלְמִיד שֶׁיּוֹשֵׁב לִפְנֵי רַבּוֹ וְרָאָה זְכוּת לֶעָנִי וְחוֹבָה לֶעָשִׁיר, מִנַּיִין שֶׁלֹּא יִשְׁתּוֹק? שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לֹא תָגוּרוּ מִפְּנֵי אִישׁ״. רַבִּי חָנִין אוֹמֵר: לֹא תַּכְנִיס דְּבָרֶיךָ מִפְּנֵי אִישׁ. וִיהוּ עֵדִים יוֹדְעִים אֶת מִי הֵן מְעִידִין, וְלִפְנֵי מִי הֵן מְעִידִין, וּמִי עָתִיד לִיפָּרַע מֵהֶן, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְעָמְדוּ שְׁנֵי הָאֲנָשִׁים אֲשֶׁר לָהֶם הָרִיב לִפְנֵי ה׳״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korḥa says: From where that a student who is sitting before his teacher and sees merit for a poor person or liability for a wealthy person, from where that he should not be silent? As it is stated: “You shall not be afraid before any man”; Rabbi Ḥanin says: Do not suppress your statement before man. And the witnesses should know about whom they are testifying, and before Whom they are testifying, and Who will ultimately exact payment from them, as it is stated: “Then both the men, between whom the controversy is, shall stand before the Lord”
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korcha says: From where do we derive that a student who sits before his teacher and sees merit for the poor and liability for the rich, from where do we derive that he should not remain silent? As it is stated: "Do not show deference to a person." Rabbi Chanin says: Do not introduce your words before a person. And there are witnesses who know whom they are testifying against, and before whom they are testifying, and who will ultimately exact retribution from them, as it is stated: "And the two men who have the dispute shall stand before the Lord."

hebrew_text: וִיהוּ הַדַּיָּינִין יוֹדְעִין אֶת מִי הֵן דָּנִין, וְלִפְנֵי מִי הֵן דָּנִין, וּמִי עָתִיד לִיפָּרַע מֵהֶן, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אֱלֹהִים נִצָּב בַּעֲדַת אֵל״. וְכֵן בִּיהוֹשָׁפָט הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״וַיֹּאמֶר אֶל הַשֹּׁפְטִים רְאוּ מָה אַתֶּם עֹשִׂים כִּי לֹא לְאָדָם תִּשְׁפְּטוּ כִּי אִם לַה׳״. שֶׁמָּא יֹאמַר הַדַּיָּין: מָה לִי בְּצַעַר הַזֶּה? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״עִמָּכֶם בִּדְבַר מִשְׁפָּט״. אֵין לוֹ לַדַּיָּין אֶלָּא מַה שֶּׁעֵינָיו רוֹאוֹת.
human_translation: And the judges should know whom they are judging, and before Whom they are judging, and Who will ultimately exact payment from them, as it is stated: “God stands in the congregation of God” And similarly, with regard to Jehoshaphat it says: “And he said to the judges: Consider what you do; for you judge not for man, but for the Lord” lest the judge say: What for me with this suffering? The verse states: “He is with you in giving judgment,” a judge has only that which his eyes see.
llm_translation: The judges know who they are judging, and before whom they are judging, and who will ultimately exact retribution from them, as it is stated: "God stands in the congregation of God." Similarly, Jehoshaphat said: "And he said to the judges, 'Consider what you are doing, for you do not judge for man but for the Lord.'" Lest the judge say, "What concern is it of mine in this trouble?" It is taught: "With you is the matter of judgment." The judge has only what his eyes see.

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי דָּמֵי גְּמַר דִּין? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: אִישׁ פְּלוֹנִי אַתָּה חַיָּיב, אִישׁ פְּלוֹנִי אַתָּה זַכַּאי. אָמַר רַב: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן קׇרְחָה. אִינִי? וְהָא רַב הוּנָא תַּלְמִידֵיהּ דְּרַב הֲוָה! כִּי הֲוָה אָתוּ לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב הוּנָא אָמַר לְהוּ: אִי דִּינָא בָּעֵיתוּ, אִי פְּשָׁרָה בָּעֵיתוּ? מַאי ״מִצְוָה״ נָמֵי דְּקָאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן קׇרְחָה?
human_translation: What are the circumstances a verdict, Rav Yehuda says Rav says: So-and-so, you are liable; so-and-so, you are exonerated. Rav says: The halakha in accordance with Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korḥa, Is that so? And was it Rav Huna was a student of Rav, when would come before Rav Huna he would say to them: Do you want judgment, do you want a compromise? What Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korḥa that he says a mitzva?
llm_translation: How is the judgment finalized? Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: "You are liable, so-and-so, and you are acquitted, so-and-so." Rav said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korḥa. Is it not so? But Rav Huna's students were present! When they came before Rav Huna, he said to them: "Do you seek judgment, or do you seek compromise?" What is the meaning of "mitzvah" that Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korḥa is also saying?

hebrew_text: מִצְוָה לְמֵימְרָא לְהוּ: אִי דִּינָא בָּעֵיתוּ, אִי פְּשָׁרָה בָּעֵיתוּ? הַיְינוּ תַּנָּא קַמָּא! אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ מִצְוָה: רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן קׇרְחָה סָבַר מִצְוָה, תַּנָּא קַמָּא סָבַר רְשׁוּת.
human_translation: a mitzva to say to them: Do you want judgment, do you want a compromise? is the first tanna , between a mitzva Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korḥa holds a mitzva the first tanna holds permitted.
llm_translation: It is a commandment to say to them: Is it a matter of law that you seek, or is it a matter of interpretation that you seek? That is the first teaching! There is a difference between them: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korcha holds it is a commandment, the first Tanna holds it is optional.

hebrew_text: הַיְינוּ דְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן מְנַסְיָא? אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ: מִשֶּׁתִּשְׁמַע דִּבְרֵיהֶן וְאַתָּה יוֹדֵעַ לְהֵיכָן הַדִּין נוֹטֶה, אִי אַתָּה רַשַּׁאי לוֹמַר לָהֶן ״צְאוּ וּבִצְעוּ״.
human_translation: is of Rabbi Shimon ben Menasya. between them After you hear their statements and you know where the judgment is leaning, is not permitted you to say to them: Go out and mediate.
llm_translation: That is like Rabbi Shimon ben Menasya? There is a difference between them: when you hear their words and you know where the law leans, if you are able to say to them, "Go out and cut."

hebrew_text: וּפְלִיגָא דְּרַבִּי תַּנְחוּם בַּר חֲנִילַאי, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי תַּנְחוּם בַּר חֲנִילַאי: לֹא נֶאֱמַר מִקְרָא זֶה אֶלָּא כְּנֶגֶד מַעֲשֵׂה הָעֵגֶל, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיַּרְא אַהֲרֹן וַיִּבֶן מִזְבֵּחַ לְפָנָיו״. מָה רָאָה? אָמַר רַבִּי בִּנְיָמִין בַּר יֶפֶת אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: רָאָה חוּר שֶׁזָּבוּחַ לְפָנָיו.
human_translation: And disagree with of Rabbi Tanḥum bar Ḥanilai. As Rabbi Tanḥum bar Ḥanilai says: This verse was stated only with regard to the incident of the Calf, as it is stated: “And Aaron saw this, and he built [ vayyiven ] an altar [ mizbe’aḥ ] before it… What see? Rabbi Binyamin bar Yefet says Rabbi Elazar says: He saw Hur, who slaughtered before him,
llm_translation: Disagreement of Rabbi Tanḥum bar Ḥanilai, for Rabbi Tanḥum bar Ḥanilai said: This verse was only stated in relation to the incident of the Golden Calf, as it is stated: "And Aaron saw and built an altar before him." What did he see? Rabbi Benjamin bar Yefet said in the name of Rabbi Elazar: He saw a cavity that was being dug before him.

hebrew_text: אָמַר: אִי לָא שָׁמַעְנָא לְהוּ הַשְׁתָּא, עָבְדוּ לִי כְּדַעֲבַדוּ בְּחוּר, וּמִיקַּיַים בִּי ״אִם יֵהָרֵג בְּמִקְדַּשׁ ה׳ כֹּהֵן וְנָבִיא״, וְלָא הָוְיָא לְהוּ תַּקַּנְתָּא לְעוֹלָם. מוּטָב דְּלִיעְבְּדוּ לְעֵגֶל, אֶפְשָׁר הָוְיָא לְהוּ תַּקַּנְתָּא בִּתְשׁוּבָה.
human_translation: said If I do not listen to them now, they will do to me as they did to Hur, “Shall the priest and the prophet be slain in the sanctuary of the Lord?” will be fulfilled through me, and they will never have a remedy better to worship the calf, possible they will have a remedy through repentance.
llm_translation: He said: If we had not heard it now, they would have served me as they served a young man, and the verse "If a priest or a prophet is killed in the sanctuary of the Lord" would be fulfilled in me, and there would be no remedy for them forever. It is better that they serve an idol, perhaps there would be a remedy for them through repentance.

hebrew_text: וְהָנֵי תַּנָּאֵי ״פּוֹטֵר מַיִם רֵאשִׁית מָדוֹן״, מַאי דָּרְשִׁי בֵּיהּ? כִּדְרַב הַמְנוּנָא, דְּאָמַר רַב הַמְנוּנָא: אֵין תְּחִילַּת דִּינוֹ שֶׁל אָדָם נִידּוֹן אֶלָּא עַל דִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״פּוֹטֵר מַיִם רֵאשִׁית מָדוֹן״. אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: הַאי תִּיגְרָא דָּמְיָא לְצִינּוֹרָא דְּבִידְקָא (דְּמַיָּא), כֵּיוָן דְּרָוַוח – רָוַוח.
human_translation: And those tanna’im “The beginning of strife is as when one releases water” what do they derive from in accordance with of Rav Hamnuna, as Rav Hamnuna says: The beginning of a person’s judgment judged only concerning matters of Torah, as it is stated: “The beginning of strife is as when one releases water.” Rav Huna says: This quarrel comparable to a hose a burst of water, once widens, it widens
llm_translation: The following Tannaim said, "One who refrains from engaging in disputes at the outset, what did he interpret in it?" Like Rav Hamnuna, as Rav Hamnuna said: The beginning of a person's judgment is only judged based on matters of Torah, as it is stated: "One who refrains from water is the beginning of strife." Rav Huna said: This dispute is similar to a pipe of a cistern that is checked, once it is opened - it is opened.

hebrew_text: אַבָּיֵי קַשִּׁישָׁא אָמַר: דָּמֵי לְגוּדָּא דְּגַמְלָא, כֵּיוָן דְּקָם – קָם.
human_translation: Abaye the Elder says: comparable to a board in bridge. Once has stood stand
llm_translation: Abbaye the Elder said: The blood of a camel is similar to a thick rope, once it stands - it stands.

hebrew_text: שִׁמְעִי וּשְׁתֵּי שֶׁבַע זְמִירוֹת הוּא, סִימָן.
human_translation: Shimi ushti , sheva zemirot hu a mnemonic
llm_translation: Shimi and Sheitei Sheva Zemirot hu, siman.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא דַּהֲוָה קָאָמַר וְאָזֵיל: טוּבֵיהּ דְּשָׁמַע וְאָדֵישׁ, חַלְפוּהּ בִּישָׁתֵיהּ מְאָה. אֲמַר לֵיהּ שְׁמוּאֵל לְרַב יְהוּדָה, קְרָא כְּתִיב: ״פּוֹטֵר מַיִם רֵאשִׁית מָדוֹן״ – רֵישׁ מְאָה דִּינֵי.
human_translation: a certain who was saying as he walked: It is good who hears and remains silent, a hundred misfortunes pass him by Shmuel said to Rav Yehuda: A verse written “The beginning of strife is as when one releases water” The beginning of one hundred litigations [ reish me’a dinei ].
llm_translation: That one who was standing and leaving: His good name is diligent, his half in his pocket a hundred. Samuel said to Rav Yehudah, a verse is written: "He who stops a quarrel before it starts" - the beginning of a hundred judgments.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא דַּהֲוָה קָאָמַר וְאָזֵיל: אַתַּרְתֵּי תְּלָת גַּנָּבָא לָא מִיקְּטַל. אֲמַר לֵיהּ שְׁמוּאֵל לְרַב יְהוּדָה, קְרָא כְּתִיב: ״כֹּה אָמַר ה׳ עַל שְׁלֹשָׁה פִּשְׁעֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל וְעַל אַרְבָּעָה לֹא אֲשִׁיבֶנּוּ״.
human_translation: a certain who was saying as he walked For two three the thief not executed Shmuel said to Rav Yehuda: A verse written “So says the Lord: For three transgressions of Israel, or for four, I will not repay it”
llm_translation: That one who was saying and going: The place of three thieves is not killed. Samuel said to Rav Yehudah, read as it is written: "Thus says the Lord: For three transgressions of Israel, and for four, I will not revoke it."

hebrew_text: הָהוּא דַּהֲוָה קָאָמַר וְאָזֵיל: שַׁב בֵּירֵי לִשְׁלָמָנָא, וַחֲדָא לְעָבֵיד בִּישׁ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ שְׁמוּאֵל לְרַב יְהוּדָה, קְרָא כְּתִיב: ״כִּי שֶׁבַע יִפּוֹל צַדִּיק וָקָם וְרָשָׁע יִפּוֹל בְּאַחַת״.
human_translation: a certain who was saying as he walked: Seven pits for the man of peace, and one for the evildoer, Shmuel said to Rav Yehuda: A verse written “For a righteous man falls seven times, and rises up again, but the wicked shall fall at once”
llm_translation: That one who was standing and going: He sat in the study hall for peace, and one was doing evil. Samuel said to Rav Yehudah, a verse is written: "For though the righteous fall seven times, they rise again, but the wicked stumble when calamity strikes."

hebrew_text: הָהוּא דַּהֲוָה קָאָמַר וְאָזֵיל: דְּאָזֵיל מִבֵּי דִינָא שְׁקִל גְּלִימָא – לִיזַמַּר זְמָר וְלֵיזִיל בְּאוֹרְחָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ שְׁמוּאֵל לְרַב יְהוּדָה, קְרָא כְּתִיב: ״וְגַם כׇּל הָעָם הַזֶּה עַל מְקֹמוֹ יָבֹא בְשָׁלוֹם״.
human_translation: a certain who was saying as he walked: who goes from the court, cloak taken let him sing a song and go on the way. Shmuel said to Rav Yehuda: A verse written “And all these people shall also go to their place in peace”
llm_translation: That one who was standing and going: as he was going from the court, he took a cloak - to sing a song and go on his way. Samuel said to Rav Yehudah, a verse is written: "And all this people shall come to his place in peace."

hebrew_text: הָהוּא דַּהֲוָה קָאָמַר וְאָזֵיל: הִיא נָיְימָא, וְדִיקּוּלָא שָׁפֵיל. אֲמַר לֵיהּ שְׁמוּאֵל לְרַב יְהוּדָה, קְרָא כְּתִיב: ״בַּעֲצַלְתַּיִם יִמַּךְ הַמְּקָרֶה וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: a certain who was saying as he walked: she is dozing the reed basket falls. Shmuel said to Rav Yehuda: A verse written “By laziness the rafters sink in;
llm_translation: That one who was standing and going said: "She is pleasant, and the basket is low." Samuel said to Rav Yehudah, "Read as it is written: 'Through sloth the roof sinks in, and through idleness of the hands the house leaks.'"

hebrew_text: הָהוּא דַּהֲוָה קָאָמַר וְאָזֵיל: גַּבְרָא דִּרְחִיצְנָא עֲלֵיהּ, אַדְיֵיהּ לִגְזִיזֵיהּ וְקָם. אָמַר לֵיהּ שְׁמוּאֵל לְרַב יְהוּדָה, קְרָא כְּתִיב: ״גַּם אִישׁ שְׁלוֹמִי אֲשֶׁר בָּטַחְתִּי בוֹ וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: a certain who was saying as he walked: The man upon whom I relied lifted his fist [ ligzizeih ] and stood Shmuel said to Rav Yehuda: A verse written “Indeed, my own familiar friend, in whom I trusted,
llm_translation: That one who was standing and going: a man of the bathhouse upon him, his cloak he removed and stood. Said to him Samuel to Rav Yehudah, read as it is written: "Even my close friend in whom I trusted, etc."

hebrew_text: הָהוּא דַּהֲוָה קָאָמַר וְאָזֵיל: כִּי רְחִימְתִּין הֲוָה עַזִּיזָא, אַפּוּתְיָא דְּסַפְסֵירָא שְׁכִיבַן. הַשְׁתָּא דְּלָא עַזִּיזָא רְחִימְתִּין, פּוּרְיָא בַּר שִׁיתִּין גַּרְמִידֵי לָא סַגִּי לַן. אָמַר רַב הוּנָא, קְרָאֵי כְּתִיבִי. מֵעִיקָּרָא כְּתִיב: ״וְנוֹעַדְתִּי לְךָ שָׁם וְדִבַּרְתִּי אִתְּךָ מֵעַל הַכַּפֹּרֶת״, וְתַנְיָא: אָרוֹן תִּשְׁעָה וְכַפּוֹרֶת טֶפַח, הֲרֵי כָּאן עֲשָׂרָה.
human_translation: a certain who was saying as he walked: When our love was strong, we slept on the width of a sword. Now that our love is not strong, a bed of sixty cubits not sufficient for us. Rav Huna said: Verses written Initially, it was written: “I will meet with you there and I will speak with you from above the Ark Cover” and it is taught Ark nine and Ark Cover handbreadth There ten here.
llm_translation: That one who was standing and going said: "When the mercy was strong, the strength of the impure ones was weakened. Now that the mercy is not strong, the offspring of the sixth generation do not suffice for us." Rav Huna said, "The verses are written. Initially it is written: 'And I will meet with you there and speak with you from above the mercy seat.' And it was taught: The Ark was nine handbreadths and the mercy seat was one handbreadth, thus here are ten."

hebrew_text: וּכְתִיב: ״וְהַבַּיִת אֲשֶׁר בָּנָה הַמֶּלֶךְ שְׁלֹמֹה לַה׳ שִׁשִּׁים אַמָּה אׇרְכּוֹ וְעֶשְׂרִים רׇחְבּוֹ וּשְׁלֹשִׁים אַמָּה קוֹמָתוֹ״. וּלְבַסּוֹף כְּתִיב: ״כֹּה אָמַר ה׳ הַשָּׁמַיִם כִּסְאִי וְהָאָרֶץ הֲדֹם רַגְלָי אֵיזֶה בַיִת אֲשֶׁר תִּבְנוּ לִי וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: And it is written: “And the house that King Solomon built for the Lord, its length was sixty cubits, and its breadth twenty cubits, and its height thirty cubits” And at the end, it is written: “Thus says the Lord: The heaven is My throne, and the earth is My footstool; where is the house that you may build for Me?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it is written: "And the house that King Solomon built for the Lord, sixty cubits its length and twenty its width and thirty cubits its height." And ultimately it is written: "So says the Lord: 'The heavens are My throne and the earth is the footstool for My feet. What house will you build for Me, etc.'"

hebrew_text: מַאי מַשְׁמַע דְּהַאי ״לֹא תָגוּרוּ״ לִישָּׁנָא דְּכַנּוֹשֵׁי הוּא? אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן, אָמַר קְרָא: ״וְיַיִן לֹא תִשְׁתֶּה וְלֹא תֶאֱגֹר״. רַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב אָמַר מֵהָכָא: ״תָּכִין בַּקַּיִץ לַחְמָהּ אָגְרָה בַקָּצִיר מַאֲכָלָהּ״. רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִיקָא אָמַר מֵהָכָא: ״אֹגֵר בַּקַּיִץ בֵּן מַשְׂכִּיל״.
human_translation: From where may be inferred that this “You shall not be afraid [ taguru ]” is a term for gathering in, Rav Naḥman said: The verse states: but you shall neither drink of the wine, nor gather [ te’egor ]” Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov says from here: “She provides her bread in the summer, and gathers [ agra ] her food in the harvest” Rav Aḥa, son of Rav Ika, says from here: “A wise son gathers [ oger ] in the summer”
llm_translation: What is the implication that "you shall not sow" refers to the prohibition against wine? Rav Nachman said, Scripture says: "And wine you shall not drink, nor shall you store." Rav Acha bar Yaakov said from here: "She prepares her bread in summer, she gathers her food in harvest." Rav Acha, son of Rav Ika, said from here: "He who gathers in the summer is a son of understanding."

hebrew_text: אֱמֶת מָמוֹן יִרְאָה סִימָן. אָמַר רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן: כׇּל דַּיָּין שֶׁדָּן דִּין אֱמֶת לַאֲמִיתּוֹ, מַשְׁרֶה שְׁכִינָה בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אֱלֹהִים נִצָּב בַּעֲדַת אֵל בְּקֶרֶב אֱלֹהִים יִשְׁפֹּט״. וְכׇל דַּיָּין שֶׁאֵינוֹ דָּן דִּין אֱמֶת לַאֲמִיתּוֹ, גּוֹרֵם לִשְׁכִינָה שֶׁתִּסְתַּלֵּק מִיִּשְׂרָאֵל, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״מִשֹּׁד עֲנִיִּים מֵאַנְקַת אֶבְיוֹנִים עַתָּה אָקוּם יֹאמַר ה׳ וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: a mnemonic Emet mamon yireh . Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani says Rabbi Yonatan says: Any judge who judges a judgment absolute truth causes the Divine Presence to rest among Israel, as it is stated: “God stands in the congregation of God; in the midst of the judges He judges” And every judge who does not judge a judgment absolute truth causes the Divine Presence to withdraw from Israel, as it is stated: “For the oppression of the poor, for the sighing of the needy, now will I arise, says the Lord”
llm_translation: Truth, money, fear, sign. Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said in the name of Rabbi Yonatan: Any judge who judges a true judgment, the Divine Presence dwells among Israel, as it is stated: "Elohim stands in the congregation of El, in the midst of gods He judges." And any judge who does not judge a true judgment, causes the Divine Presence to depart from Israel, as it is stated: "Because of the oppression of the poor, because of the sighing of the needy, now I will arise, says the Lord, etc."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן: כׇּל דַּיָּין שֶׁנּוֹטֵל מִזֶּה וְנוֹתֵן לְזֶה שֶׁלֹּא כַּדִּין, הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא נוֹטֵל מִמֶּנּוּ נַפְשׁוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אַל תִּגְזׇל דַּל כִּי דַּל הוּא וְאַל תְּדַכֵּא עָנִי בַשָּׁעַר כִּי ה׳ יָרִיב רִיבָם וְקָבַע אֶת קֹבְעֵיהֶם נָפֶשׁ״.
human_translation: And Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani says Rabbi Yonatan says: any judge who takes from this and gives to that unlawfully, the Holy One, Blessed be He, takes his soul from him as it is stated: “Rob not the weak, because he is weak, neither crush the poor in the gate; for the Lord will plead their cause and despoil of life those who despoil them”
llm_translation: And Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said in the name of Rabbi Yonatan: Any judge who takes from this one and gives to that one unjustly, the Holy One, blessed be He, takes his soul from him, as it is said: "Do not rob the poor because he is poor, and do not crush the afflicted at the gate, for the Lord will plead their cause and despoil the life of those who despoil them."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן: לְעוֹלָם יִרְאֶה דַּיָּין עַצְמוֹ כְּאִילּוּ חֶרֶב מוּנַּחַת לוֹ בֵּין יַרְכוֹתָיו, וְגֵיהִנָּם פְּתוּחָה לוֹ מִתַּחְתָּיו.
human_translation: And Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani says Rabbi Yonatan says: A judge should always view himself as if a sword is placed between his thighs, and Gehenna is opened up beneath him,
llm_translation: And Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said in the name of Rabbi Yonatan: Always should a judge see himself as if a sharp sword is placed between his thighs, and Gehinnom is open beneath him.

hebrew_text: שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הִנֵּה מִטָּתוֹ שֶׁלִּשְׁלֹמֹה שִׁשִּׁים גִּבֹּרִים סָבִיב לָהּ מִגִּבֹּרֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל כֻּלָּם אֲחֻזֵי חֶרֶב מְלֻמְּדֵי מִלְחָמָה אִישׁ חַרְבּוֹ עַל יְרֵכוֹ מִפַּחַד בַּלֵּילוֹת״. מִפַּחְדָּהּ שֶׁל גֵּיהִנָּם, שֶׁדּוֹמָה לְלַיְלָה.
human_translation: as it is stated: “Behold, it is the bed of Solomon; sixty mighty men are around it, of the mighty men of Israel. They all handle the sword, and are expert in war; every man has his sword upon his thigh due to dread in the night” due to the dread of Gehenna, which is similar to the night.
llm_translation: As it is stated: "Behold, it is the bed of Solomon, surrounded by sixty mighty men from the mighty men of Israel, all holding swords, trained in warfare, each man with his sword on his thigh, because of terror in the nights." This terror is the terror of Gehinnom, which is similar to night.

hebrew_text: דָּרַשׁ רַבִּי יֹאשִׁיָּה, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק, מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״בֵּית דָּוִד כֹּה אָמַר ה׳ דִּינוּ לַבֹּקֶר מִשְׁפָּט וְהַצִּילוּ גָזוּל מִיַּד עוֹשֵׁק״ – וְכִי בַּבֹּקֶר דָּנִין וְכׇל הַיּוֹם אֵין דָּנִין? אֶלָּא אִם בָּרוּר לְךָ הַדָּבָר כַּבֹּקֶר – אׇמְרֵהוּ, וְאִם לָאו – אַל תֹּאמְרֵהוּ. רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן, מֵהָכָא: ״אֱמֹר לַחׇכְמָה אֲחֹתִי אָתְּ״ – אִם בָּרוּר לְךָ הַדָּבָר כַּאֲחוֹתְךָ שֶׁהִיא אֲסוּרָה לְךָ – אוֹמְרֵהוּ, וְאִם לָאו – אַל תֹּאמְרֵהוּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoshiya, and some say Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak, interpreted homiletically. What which is written: “House of David, so says the Lord: Execute justice in the morning, and deliver the spoiled out of the hand of the oppressor” And so may judge in the morning, and all the day may not judge? Rather, If the matter is as clear to you as the morning, state and if not, do not state it. Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba says Rabbi Yonatan from here: “Say to wisdom: You are my sister” If the matter is clear to you as that your sister is forbidden to you, state it, and if not, do not state it.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yoshiyah expounded, and it was stated by Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak, what is the meaning of what is written: "The house of David, thus said the Lord: Judge in the morning justice, and deliver the robbed out of the hand of the oppressor" - Do we only judge in the morning and not the entire day? Rather, if the matter is clear to you like the morning - say it, and if not - do not say it. Rabbi Chiya bar Abba said in the name of Rabbi Yonatan, from here: "Say to wisdom, 'You are my sister'" - If the matter is clear to you like your sister who is forbidden to you - say it, and if not - do not say it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: עֲשָׂרָה שֶׁיּוֹשְׁבִין בַּדִּין, קוֹלָר תָּלוּי בְּצַוַּאר כּוּלָּן. פְּשִׁיטָא! לָא צְרִיכָא אֶלָּא לְתַלְמִיד הַיּוֹשֵׁב לִפְנֵי רַבּוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi says: ten are sitting in judgment, collar [ kolar ], hangs around all of their necks. obvious is necessary only to a student who is sitting in front of his teacher
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: Ten who sit in judgment, a collar is hanging on all of them. It is obvious! This is necessary only for a student who sits before his teacher.

hebrew_text: רַב הוּנָא, כִּי הֲוָה אָתֵי דִּינָא לְקַמֵּיהּ, מְיכַנֵּיף וּמַיְיתִי עֲשָׂרָה רַבָּנַן מִבֵּי רַב. אָמַר: כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלִימְטְיַין שִׁיבָּא מִכְּשׁוּרָא. רַב אָשֵׁי, כִּי הֲוָה אָתֵי טְרֵיפְתָּא לְקַמֵּיהּ, מְכַנֵּיף וּמַיְיתֵי לְהוּ לְכוּלְּהוּ טַבָּחֵי דְּמָתָא מַחְסֵיָא. אָמַר: כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלִימְטְיַין שִׁיבָּא מִכְּשׁוּרָא.
human_translation: Rav Huna when would come before him judgment, gather and bring ten rabbis from Rav’s study hall. would say: so that a splinter from a beam, will reach us. Rav Ashi, when would come before him an animal with a wound that will cause it to die within twelve months [ tereifta ], would gather and bring all the butchers of Mata Meḥasya would say so that a splinter from a beam, will reach us.
llm_translation: Rav Huna, when a case would come before him, he would bow and bring ten rabbis from the house of Rav. He said: "So that the elders may return from the market." Rav Ashi, when a case of a treifah would come before him, he would bow and bring all the butchers of the town of Mahseya. He said: "So that the elders may return from the market."

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא רַב דִּימִי אָמַר: דָּרַשׁ רַב נַחְמָן בַּר כֹּהֵן, מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״מֶלֶךְ בְּמִשְׁפָּט יַעֲמִיד אָרֶץ וְאִישׁ תְּרוּמוֹת יֶהֶרְסֶנָּה״? אִם דַּיָּין דּוֹמֶה לְמֶלֶךְ שֶׁאֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ לִכְלוּם – יַעֲמִיד אָרֶץ, וְאִם דּוֹמֶה לְכֹהֵן שֶׁמְּחַזֵּר בְּבֵית הַגְּרָנוֹת – יֶהֶרְסֶנָּה.
human_translation: When Rav Dimi came said: Rav Naḥman bar Kohen interpreted homiletically: What which is written: “The king by justice establishes the land; but he who exacts gifts [ terumot ] overthrows it” if the judge like a king that he does not need anything establishes the land, But if he is like a priest who seeks out from granaries, overthrows
llm_translation: When Rav Dimi came, he said: Rav Nachman bar Kokhein expounded, what is the meaning of what is written: "A king with justice establishes the land, but a man of gifts tears it down"? If the judge is like a king who does not need to be ashamed – he will establish the land, but if he is like a priest who frequents the granaries – he will tear it down.

hebrew_text: דְּבֵי נְשִׂיאָה אוֹקְמוּ דַּיָּינָא דְּלָא הֲוָה גְּמִיר. אֲמַר לֵיהּ לִיהוּדָה בַּר נַחְמָנִי, מְתוּרְגְּמָנֵיהּ דְּרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: ״קוּם עֲלֵיהּ בְּאָמוֹרָא״. קָם, גְּחֵין עֲלֵיהּ, וְלָא אֲמַר לֵיהּ וְלָא מִידֵּי.
human_translation: In the house of the Nasi , they appointed a judge who was not learned. said to Yehuda bar Naḥmani, interpreter of Reish Lakish Stand over as an interpreter, arose bent over him And, did not say anything to him.
llm_translation: In the house of the president, they established a wine cellar that was not complete. He said to Judah son of Nachmani, the interpreter of Reish Lakish: "Arise upon it with a saying." He arose, leaned upon it, and did not say anything to him, nor did he respond.

hebrew_text: פָּתַח וְאָמַר: ״הוֹי אוֹמֵר לָעֵץ הָקִיצָה עוּרִי לְאֶבֶן דּוּמָם הוּא יוֹרֶה הִנֵּה הוּא תָּפוּשׂ זָהָב וָכֶסֶף וְכׇל רוּחַ אֵין בְּקִרְבּוֹ״. וְעָתִיד הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לִיפָּרַע מִמַּעֲמִידָן, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַה׳ בְּהֵיכַל קׇדְשׁוֹ הַס מִפָּנָיו כׇּל הָאָרֶץ״.
human_translation: began and said: “Woe to him who says to the wood: Awake, to the dumb stone: Arise. Can this teach? Behold, it is overlaid with gold and silver, and there is no breath at all in the midst of it” And future, the Holy One, Blessed be He, will punish those who appoint as it is stated “But the Lord is in His holy Sanctuary; let all the earth be silent before Him”
llm_translation: He opened and said: "Woe, he says to the wood, 'Awaken!' to the dumb stone, 'Arise!' Behold, it is overlaid with gold and silver, but there is no spirit within it." And the Holy One, blessed be He, is destined to exact retribution from them, as it is stated: "And the Lord is in His holy temple; let all the earth keep silence before Him."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: כׇּל הַמַּעֲמִיד דַּיָּין עַל הַצִּיבּוּר שֶׁאֵינוֹ הָגוּן, כְּאִילּוּ נוֹטֵעַ אֲשֵׁירָה בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״שֹׁפְטִים וְשֹׁטְרִים תִּתֶּן לְךָ״, וּסְמִיךְ לֵיהּ: ״לֹא תִטַּע לְךָ אֲשֵׁרָה כָּל עֵץ״. אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: וּבִמְקוֹם שֶׁיֵּשׁ תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים, כְּאִילּוּ נְטָעוֹ אֵצֶל מִזְבֵּחַ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אֵצֶל מִזְבַּח ה׳ אֱלֹהֶיךָ״.
human_translation: Reish Lakish says: anyone who appoints over the community a judge who is not fit, as though plants a tree [ ashera ] among the Jewish people, as it is stated: “You shall make judges and officers for yourself” and juxtaposed to it, “You shall not plant yourself an ashera of any kind of tree” Rav Ashi says: And in a place where there are Torah scholars, as though planted next to the altar, as it is stated: beside the altar of the Lord your God.”
llm_translation: Reish Lakish said: Anyone who appoints an unfit judge over the community is as if he planted an Asherah tree in Israel, as it is stated: "Judges and officers you shall appoint for yourself," and juxtaposed to it: "You shall not plant for yourself an Asherah of any tree." Rav Ashe said: And in a place where there are Torah scholars, it is as if he planted it next to the altar, as it is stated: "Beside the altar of the Lord your God."

hebrew_text: כְּתִיב: ״לֹא תַעֲשׂוּן אִתִּי אֱלֹהֵי כֶסֶף וֵאלֹהֵי זָהָב״. אֱלֹהֵי כֶסֶף וֵאלֹהֵי זָהָב הוּא דְּלָא עָבְדִי, הָא דְּעֵץ שְׁרֵי? אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: אֱלוֹהַּ הַבָּא בִּשְׁבִיל כֶּסֶף, וֶאֱלוֹהַּ הַבָּא בִּשְׁבִיל זָהָב.
human_translation: written: “You shall not make with Me gods of [ elohei ] silver and gods of gold” gods of silver and gods of gold that not make, but of wood permitted? Rav Ashi says: a judge, who comes, due to silver, and a judge who comes due to gold.
llm_translation: It is written: "You shall not make with Me gods of silver and gods of gold." Gods of silver and gods of gold, that is for not serving, what about the one made of wood? Rav Ashi said: If one comes for the sake of silver, and one comes for the sake of gold.

hebrew_text: רַב, כִּי הֲוָה אָתֵי לְבֵי דִּינָא, אָמַר הָכִי: בִּרְעוּת נַפְשֵׁיהּ לִקְטָלָא נָפֵיק, וּצְבוּ בֵּיתֵיהּ לֵית הוּא עָבֵיד, וְרֵיקָן לְבֵיתֵיהּ עָיֵיל. וּלְוַאי שֶׁתְּהֵא בִּיאָה כִּיצִיאָה.
human_translation: Rav, when he would come to court would say this By his own will goes out to death, and he does not do the needs of his house, and he enters his home empty-handed, If only entry will be as departure,
llm_translation: Rav, when he would come to the house of judgment, would say thus: "With the willingness of his soul to be killed he went out, and his house is not doing anything, and his house is empty." And if only his coming would be like his going out.

hebrew_text: כִּי הָוֵי חָזֵי אַמְבּוּהָא דְסָפְרֵי אַבָּתְרֵיהּ, אָמַר: ״אִם יַעֲלֶה לַשָּׁמַיִם שִׂיאוֹ [וְגוֹ׳] כְּגֶלְלוֹ לָנֶצַח יֹאבֵד וְגוֹ׳״. מָר זוּטְרָא חֲסִידָא, כִּי הֲווֹ מְכַתְּפִי לֵיהּ בְּשַׁבְּתָא דְרִיגְלָא, אָמַר הָכִי: ״כִּי לֹא לְעוֹלָם חֹסֶן וְאִם נֵזֶר לְדוֹר וָדוֹר״.
human_translation: when would see a convoy [ ambuha ] of scribes after him would say: “Though his excellency mount up to the heavens yet he shall perish forever like his own dung; Mar Zutra the Pious when would carry him on their shoulders during Shabbat of the Festival, say this “For power is not forever, and does the crown endure for all generations?”
llm_translation: When he would see the gathering of the books of his ancestors, he said: "If his loftiness will ascend to the heavens etc. like his wheel, Joab will perish forever etc.." Mar Zutra the pious, when they would remove him on the Sabbath eve, he would say thus: "For wealth is not forever, and a crown is not for generation and generation."

hebrew_text: דָּרֵשׁ בַּר קַפָּרָא: מְנָא הָא מִילְּתָא דַּאֲמַרוּ רַבָּנַן, ״הֱווּ מְתוּנִין בַּדִּין״? דִּכְתִיב: ״לֹא תַעֲלֶה בְמַעֲלֹת״, וּסְמִיךְ לֵיהּ ״וְאֵלֶּה הַמִּשְׁפָּטִים״. אָמַר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: מִנַּיִין לְדַיָּין שֶׁלֹּא יְפַסֵּעַ עַל רָאשֵׁי עַם קוֹדֶשׁ? שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לֹא תַעֲלֶה בְמַעֲלֹת״, וּסְמִיךְ לֵיהּ ״וְאֵלֶּה הַמִּשְׁפָּטִים״.
human_translation: Bar Kappara taught, From where is this matter that the Sages stated Be temperate in judgment As it is written: “Neither shall you go up by steps and juxtaposed to it, “Now these are the ordinances Rabbi Eliezer says: From where that a judge may not step over the heads of the sacred nation, which is stated: “Neither shall you go up by steps,” and juxtaposed to it “Now these are the ordinances.”
llm_translation: Bar Kappara expounded: From where is the matter that the Rabbis said, "Be cautious in judgment"? As it is written: "Do not ascend steps," and adjacent to it is: "And these are the ordinances." Rabbi Eliezer said: From where is it derived for a judge not to step on the heads of the holy people? As it is stated: "Do not ascend steps," and adjacent to it is: "And these are the ordinances."

hebrew_text: ״אֲשֶׁר תָּשִׂים״? ״אֲשֶׁר תְּלַמְּדֵם״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ! אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא: אֵלּוּ כְּלֵי הַדַּיָּינִין. רַב הוּנָא, כִּי הֲוָה נָפֵק לְדִינָא, אָמַר הָכִי: אַפִּיקוּ לִי מָאנֵי חֲנוּתַאי: מַקֵּל וּרְצוּעָה, וְשׁוֹפָרָא, וְסַנְדָּלָא.
human_translation: that you shall set should have That you shall teach them. Rabbi Yirmeya, and some say Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba, says: These are the judges’ tools. Rav Huna, when he would go out to a judgment, would say this: Take out for me tools from my shop: A rod and strap, and a shofar, and a sandal,
llm_translation: "‘That you shall place’? ‘That you shall teach them’ - what does he seek to teach from this? Rabbi Yirmeya said, and some say it was Rabbi Hiyya bar Abba: These are the vessels of the judges. Rav Huna, when he would go out to the court, would say thus: Bring me my storehouse utensils: a staff, a strap, a horn, and a sandal."

hebrew_text: ״וָאֲצַוֶּה אֶת שֹׁפְטֵיכֶם בָּעֵת הַהִיא״. אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כְּנֶגֶד מַקֵּל וּרְצוּעָה תְּהֵא זָרִיז. ״שָׁמֹעַ בֵּין אֲחֵיכֶם וּשְׁפַטְתֶּם״ – אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: אַזְהָרָה לַדַּיָּין שֶׁלֹּא יִשְׁמַע דִּבְרֵי בַּעַל דִּין קוֹדֶם שֶׁיָּבֹא בַּעַל דִּין חֲבֵירוֹ, וְאַזְהָרָה לְבַעַל דִּין שֶׁלֹּא יַטְעִים דְּבָרָיו לַדַּיָּין קוֹדֶם שֶׁיָּבֹא בַּעַל דִּין חֲבֵירוֹ. קְרִי בֵּיהּ נָמֵי: ״שַׁמַּע בֵּין אֲחֵיכֶם״.
human_translation: “And I charged your judges at that time, Rabbi Yoḥanan says: With regard to the rod and the strap, be vigilant. “Hear the causes between your brethren, and judge,” Rabbi Ḥanina says: a warning to a court that may not hear the statement of litigant before the other litigant comes, and a warning to a litigant that may not explain his statement to the judge before the other litigant comes. Read into “Hear the causes between your brethren,” also concerning
llm_translation: "And I commanded your judges at that time." Rabbi Yochanan said: Corresponding to a staff and a rod, one should be diligent. "Hear between your brothers and judge." Rabbi Chanina said: A warning to the judge not to hear the words of the litigant before his fellow judge enters, and a warning to the litigant not to influence the judge with his words before his fellow litigant enters. It is written in it: "Hear between your brothers."

hebrew_text: רַב כָּהֲנָא אָמַר: מֵהָכָא, מִ״לֹּא תִשָּׂא״ – לֹא תַשִּׂיא.
human_translation: Rav Kahana says from here: From “you shall not bear [ tissa ] You shall not deliver [ tassi ]
llm_translation: Rav Kahana said: From here, "Do not bear false witness" - do not bear.

hebrew_text: ״וּשְׁפַטְתֶּם צֶדֶק״. אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: צַדֵּק אֶת הַדִּין, וְאַחַר כָּךְ חׇתְכֵהוּ. ״בֵּין אִישׁ וּבֵין אָחִיו וּבֵין גֵּרוֹ״. אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: אֲפִילּוּ בֵּין בַּיִת לַעֲלִיָּיה.
human_translation: and judge righteously.” Reish Lakish says: Verify the judgment and afterward, implement it. “Between a man and his brother, and the stranger who is with him.” Rav Yehuda says: even between a house and the upper story
llm_translation: "And you shall judge with justice." Reish Lakish said: Establish the law justly, and then execute it. "Between a man and his brother and his stranger." Rav Yehudah said: Even between a house and an upper story.

hebrew_text: ״וּבֵין גֵּרוֹ״. אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: אֲפִילּוּ בֵּין תַּנּוּר לְכִירַיִם.
human_translation: “And the stranger who is with him [ gero ],” Rav Yehuda says: even between an oven and a stove.
llm_translation: "And between his legs." Rav Yehudah said: Even between an oven and pots.

hebrew_text: ״לֹא תַכִּירוּ פָנִים בַּמִּשְׁפָּט״. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: לֹא תַּכִּירֵהוּ. רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: לֹא תְּנַכְּרֵהוּ.
human_translation: “You shall not respect [ takiru ] people in judgment; Rabbi Yehuda says: Do not recognize him [ takirehu ], Rabbi Elazar says: do not estrange him [ tenakerehu ]
llm_translation: "Do not recognize faces in judgment." Rabbi Yehuda says: "Do not recognize him." Rabbi Elazar says: "Do not distinguish him."

hebrew_text: אוּשְׁפִּיזְכָנֵיהּ דְּרַב אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ לְדִינָא. אָמַר לוֹ: לָאו אוּשְׁפִּיזְכָנִי אַתְּ? אָמַר לוֹ: אִין. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: דִּינָא אִית לִי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ:
human_translation: Rav’s host [ ushpizekhaneih ], came before him for a judgment. said to Are you not my host? said to him: Yes, said to him: I have a judgment. said to him:
llm_translation: The officials of Rav came before him for judgment. He said to them: Are you not my officials? They said to him: No. He said to them: I have a judgment. They said to him:

hebrew_text: פְּסִילְנָא לָךְ לְדִינָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב לְרַב כָּהֲנָא: פּוֹק דַּיְּינֵיהּ. חַזְיֵיהּ דַּהֲוָה קָא גָּאֵיס בֵּיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִי צָיְיתַתְּ – צָיְיתַתְּ, וְאִי לָא – מַפֵּיקְנָא לָךְ רַב מֵאוּנָּךְ.
human_translation: I am disqualified to judge for you, Rav said to Rav Kahana: Go out judge saw that was acting haughtily said to If you listen, listen And if not, I will take Rav out of your ears.
llm_translation: Idol for you for judgment. Said to him Rav to Rav Kahana: Go judge it. He saw that he was becoming arrogant with it. He said to him: If you have listened - you have listened, and if not - I will remove you from your position.

hebrew_text: ״כַּקָּטֹן כַּגָּדֹל תִּשְׁמָעוּן״. אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: שֶׁיְּהֵא חָבִיב עָלֶיךָ דִּין שֶׁל פְּרוּטָה כְּדִין שֶׁל מֵאָה מָנֶה. לְמַאי הִלְכְתָא? אִילֵּימָא לְעַיּוֹנֵי בֵּיהּ וּמִיפְסְקֵיהּ – פְּשִׁיטָא! אֶלָּא לְאַקְדּוֹמֵיהּ.
human_translation: “You shall hear the small and the great alike” Reish Lakish says: that the judgment of one peruta should be as dear, to you as the judgment of one hundred maneh , With regard to what halakha If we say to study it and decide obvious Rather, to giving it precedence:
llm_translation: "As the small, so the great you shall hear." Reish Lakish said: Let the judgment of a minor matter be as precious to you as the judgment of a hundred maneh. What is the halakha? If you say for the sake of the scholars who study it and derive conclusions from it – it is obvious! Rather, for its predecessors.

hebrew_text: ״לֹא תָגוּרוּ מִפְּנֵי אִישׁ״. אָמַר רַבִּי חָנָן: אַל תַּכְנִיס דְּבָרֶיךָ מִפְּנֵי אִישׁ. ״כִּי הַמִּשְׁפָּט לֵאלֹהִים הוּא״. אָמַר רַבִּי חָמָא בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: אָמַר הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא, לֹא דַּיָּין לָרְשָׁעִים שֶׁנּוֹטְלִין מִזֶּה מָמוֹן וְנוֹתְנִים לָזֶה שֶׁלֹּא כַּדִּין, אֶלָּא שֶׁמַּטְרִיחִין אוֹתִי לְהַחֲזִיר מָמוֹן לִבְעָלָיו.
human_translation: “You shall not be afraid before any man.” Rabbi Ḥanan says: Do not suppress your statement due to person. “For the judgment is God’s.” Rabbi Ḥama, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, says: The Holy One, Blessed be He, says: It is not enough for the wicked that take money from this and give to that unlawfully, but trouble Me to return the money to its owners.
llm_translation: "Do not tremble because of man." Rabbi Hanan said: Do not let your words be influenced by man. "For judgment belongs to God." Rabbi Hama son of Rabbi Hanina said: The Holy One, blessed be He, said, 'It is not enough that the wicked take money from one and give it to another unjustly, but they also trouble Me to return the money to its rightful owner.'

hebrew_text: ״וְהַדָּבָר אֲשֶׁר יִקְשֶׁה מִכֶּם״. אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא וְאִיתֵּימָא רַבִּי יֹאשִׁיָּה: עַל דָּבָר זֶה נֶעֱנַשׁ מֹשֶׁה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״וַיַּקְרֵב מֹשֶׁה אֶת מִשְׁפָּטָן לִפְנֵי ה׳״. מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: מִי כְּתִיב ״וְאַשְׁמִיעֲכֶם״? ״וּשְׁמַעְתִּיו״ כְּתִיב! אִי גְּמִירְנָא – גְּמִירְנָא, וְאִי לָא – אָזֵילְנָא וּגְמִירְנָא.
human_translation: “And the cause that is too hard for you, Rabbi Ḥanina, and some say Rabbi Yoshiya, says: On this matter, Moses was punished, as it is stated: “And Moses brought their cause before the Lord” Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak objects to this Is it written: “And I will tell you,” it is written: “And I will hear it,” If I learned I learned And if not, I will go and learn
llm_translation: "The matter that is too difficult for you." Rabbi Chanina said, and some say Rabbi Yoshiyah: Regarding this matter, Moses was punished, as it is stated, "And Moses brought their case before the Lord." Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak objected: Where is it written "and I will hear it"? It is written "and I will hear him"! If we have learned it - we have learned it, and if not - we will go and learn it.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, כִּדְתַנְיָא: רְאוּיָה פָּרָשַׁת נַחֲלוֹת שֶׁתִּיכָּתֵב עַל יְדֵי מֹשֶׁה רַבֵּינוּ, אֶלָּא שֶׁזָּכוּ בְּנוֹת צְלָפְחָד וְנִכְתְּבָה עַל יָדָן. רְאוּיָה הָיְתָה פָּרָשַׁת מְקוֹשֵׁשׁ שֶׁתִּיכָּתֵב עַל יְדֵי מֹשֶׁה רַבֵּינוּ, אֶלָּא שֶׁנִּתְחַיֵּיב מְקוֹשֵׁשׁ וְנִכְתְּבָה עַל יָדוֹ. לְלַמֶּדְךָ שֶׁמְגַלְגְּלִין חוֹבָה עַל יְדֵי חַיָּיב, וּזְכוּת עַל יְדֵי זַכַּאי.
human_translation: Rather, as it is taught fitting for the portion about inheritances to have been written by Moses, our teacher, But the daughters of Zelophehad achieved merit and was written by them. would have been fitting for the portion of gatherer to have been written by Moses, our teacher. But the gatherer was found guilty, and was written by him. to teach you that guilt is engendered by means of the guilty and merit by means of the innocent.
llm_translation: Rather, as it was taught: The portion of inheritance was fitting to be written by the hand of our teacher Moses, but the daughters of Zelophehad merited it, and it was written by their hand. The portion of the suspected adulteress was fitting to be written by the hand of our teacher Moses, but the suspected adulteress confessed and it was written by her hand. This teaches you that we roll a duty upon the one obligated, and merit upon the deserving.

hebrew_text: כְּתִיב: ״וָאֲצַוֶּה אֶת שֹׁפְטֵיכֶם בָּעֵת הַהִיא״, וּכְתִיב: ״וָאֲצַוֶּה אֶתְכֶם בָּעֵת הַהִיא״. אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אָמַר רַבִּי שִׂמְלַאי: אַזְהָרָה לַצִּיבּוּר שֶׁתְּהֵא אֵימַת דַּיָּין עֲלֵיהֶן, וְאַזְהָרָה לַדַּיָּין שֶׁיִּסְבּוֹל אֶת הַצִּיבּוּר. עַד כַּמָּה? אָמַר רַבִּי חָנָן, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַבִּי שַׁבְּתַאי: ״כַּאֲשֶׁר יִשָּׂא הָאֹמֵן אֶת הַיֹּנֵק״.
human_translation: It is written: “And I charged your judges at that time” and it is written “And I commanded you at that time Rabbi Elazar says Rabbi Simlai says: a warning to the community that the awe of the judge must be upon them, and a warning to the judge that bear the community. Up to what Rabbi Ḥanan, and some say Rabbi Shabbtai, says: “as a nursing father carries the sucking child”
llm_translation: It is written: "And I commanded your judges at that time," and it is written: "And I commanded you at that time." Rabbi Elazar said in the name of Rabbi Simlai: A warning to the congregation that they should fear the judge, and a warning to the judge that he should bear the congregation. Until when? Rabbi Hanan said, and some say Rabbi Shabbatai: "As the nurse carries the suckling infant."

hebrew_text: כְּתִיב: ״כִּי אַתָּה תָּבוֹא״, וּכְתִיב: ״כִּי אַתָּה תָּבִיא״. אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אָמַר לוֹ מֹשֶׁה לִיהוֹשֻׁעַ: אַתָּה וְהַזְּקֵנִים שֶׁבַּדּוֹר עִמָּהֶם. אָמַר לוֹ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: טוֹל מַקֵּל וְהַךְ עַל קׇדְקֳדָם. דַּבָּר אֶחָד לַדּוֹר, וְאֵין שְׁנֵי דַּבָּרִין לַדּוֹר.
human_translation: It is written: “For you shall go and it is written: “For you shall bring Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Moses said to Joshua, You and the elders of the generation with the Holy One, Blessed be He, said to Take a rod and strike upon their skulls. one leader for the generation, and not two leaders for the generation.
llm_translation: It is written: "For you shall come," and it is written: "For you shall bring." Rabbi Yochanan said: Moses said to Joshua: You and the elders of that generation with you. The Holy One, blessed be He, said to him: Take a stick and strike their heads. One thing for a generation, and not two things for a generation.

hebrew_text: תָּנָא: זִימּוּן בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה. מַאי זִימּוּן? אִילֵּימָא בִּרְכַּת זִימּוּן, וְהָתַנְיָא: זִימּוּן וּבִרְכַּת זִימּוּן בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה! וְכִי תֵּימָא פָּרוֹשֵׁי קָמְפָרֵשׁ: מַאי זִימּוּן? בִּרְכַּת זִימּוּן. וְהָתַנְיָא: זִימּוּן בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה, בִּרְכַּת זִימּוּן בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה!
human_translation: taught A zimmun with three What zimmun If we say the zimmun blessing, But isn’t it taught Zimmun and the zimmun blessing are with three And if you would say explains What zimmun ? the zimmun blessing, But isn’t it taught Zimmun with three the zimmun blessing with three
llm_translation: Mishnah: Zimun with three. What is Zimun? If you say it is the blessing of Zimun, but it was taught: Zimun and the blessing of Zimun with three! And if you say the interpreters interpret: What is Zimun? The blessing of Zimun. But it was taught: Zimun with three, the blessing of Zimun with three!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מַאי זִימּוּן? אַזְמוֹנֵי לְדִין. כִּי הָא דְּאָמַר רָבָא: הָנֵי בֵּי תְלָתָא דַּיָּינֵי דְּיָתְבִי, וְאָזֵיל שְׁלִיחָא דְּבֵי דִּינָא וְאָמַר מִפּוּמָּא דְּחַד – לֹא אָמַר כְּלוּם, עַד דְּאָמַר מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּכוּלְּהוּ. הָנֵי מִילֵּי בְּלָא יוֹמָא דְּדִינָא, אֲבָל בְּיוֹמָא דְּדִינָא – לֵית לַן בַּהּ.
human_translation: Rather, what zimmun ? a summons for judgment. similar that which Rava said: this court of three judges who are sitting and the agent of the court went and said in the name of one did not say anything, unless said in the name of all of them. That statement when not the day judgment. But on the day judgment, we have no with it.
llm_translation: Rather, what is the meaning of "zimun"? It refers to those summoned for judgment. As Rava said: Those three judges who sit and the messenger of the court goes and says from the mouth of one - he did not say anything until he said it in the name of all. These matters are discussed on a non-judgment day, but on a judgment day - we do not have them.

hebrew_text: תַּשְׁלוּמֵי כֶּפֶל כּוּ׳. שְׁלַח לֵיהּ רַב נַחְמָן בַּר רַב חִסְדָּא לְרַב נַחְמָן בַּר יַעֲקֹב: יְלַמְּדֵנוּ רַבֵּינוּ, דִּינֵי קְנָסוֹת בְּכַמָּה? מַאי קָמִיבַּעְיָא לֵיהּ? הָא אֲנַן תְּנַן בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה! אֶלָּא יָחִיד מוּמְחֶה קָמִיבַּעְיָא לֵיהּ, דְּאֵין דִּינֵי קְנָסוֹת אוֹ לָא?
human_translation: payment of double Rav Naḥman bar Rav Ḥisda sent to Rav Naḥman bar Ya’akov: Let our teacher instruct us: laws of fines, by how many What is the dilemma he is raising? Didn’t we learn by three Rather, is raising a dilemma a single expert adjudicate laws of fines or not?
llm_translation: Repayments of double. Send to him Rav Nachman son of Rav Chisda to Rav Nachman son of Yaakov: Teach us, our master, in how many cases are fines imposed? What is he asking him? Behold, we learned it in three! Rather, he is asking about a unique case of a blemished animal, in which fines are imposed or not?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: תְּנֵיתוּהָ, תַּשְׁלוּמֵי כֶּפֶל וְתַשְׁלוּמֵי אַרְבָּעָה וַחֲמִשָּׁה בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה. מַאי שְׁלֹשָׁה? אִילֵּימָא שְׁלֹשָׁה הֶדְיוֹטוֹת, הָאָמַר אֲבוּהּ דַּאֲבוּךְ מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב: אֲפִילּוּ עֲשָׂרָה וְהֵן הֶדְיוֹטוֹת פְּסוּלִין לְדִינֵי קְנָסוֹת! אֶלָּא מוּמְחִין, וְקָאָמַר שְׁלֹשָׁה.
human_translation: said to him: You learned payment of double and payment of four or five by three What three? If we say three lay didn’t your father’s father say in the name of Rav: Even ten they are lay unfit for laws of fines? Rather, expert and it says three
llm_translation: He said to him: "You should give it, the payment of double and the payment of four or five in three. What is three? If you say three ordinary people, as the father of your father said in the name of Rav: Even ten, and they are ordinary people, are invalid for penalties! Rather, they are experts, and he said three."

hebrew_text: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: מוֹצִיא שֵׁם רַע בְּעֶשְׂרִים וּשְׁלֹשָׁה.
human_translation: and the Rabbis say: defamer by twenty-three
llm_translation: The sages say: One who utters a bad name in twenty-three.

hebrew_text: וְכִי יֵשׁ בּוֹ דִּינֵי נְפָשׁוֹת, מַאי הָוֵי?
human_translation: But although contains capital law, what of it?
llm_translation: And if there are in it laws of life, what is the ruling?

hebrew_text: אָמַר עוּלָּא: בְּחוֹשְׁשִׁין לְלַעַז קָמִיפַּלְגִי. רַבִּי מֵאִיר סָבַר: אֵין חוֹשְׁשִׁין לְלַעַז, וְרַבָּנַן סָבְרִי: חוֹשְׁשִׁין לְלַעַז.
human_translation: Ulla said: disagree with regard to concerned with rumors, Rabbi Meir holds not concerned with rumors. And the Rabbis hold concerned with rumors.
llm_translation: Ula said: Concerning a suspected case of foreign language, they disagree. Rabbi Meir holds: We are not concerned about foreign language, and the Rabbis hold: We are concerned about foreign language.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לְלַעַז לָא חָיְישִׁינַן, וְהָכָא בְּחוֹשְׁשִׁין לִכְבוֹדָן שֶׁל רִאשׁוֹנִים קָמִיפַּלְגִי. וְהָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן? כְּגוֹן דְּאִיכְּנִיף בֵּי עֶשְׂרִין וּתְלָתָא לְמֵידַן דִּינֵי נְפָשׁוֹת, וְאִיבַּדּוּר, וַאֲמַר לְהוּ: דַּיְּינוּ לִי מִיהָא דִּינֵי מָמוֹנוֹת.
human_translation: Rava says: Everyone not concerned with rumors. And here disagree about concerned for the honor of the first And with what are we dealing here? for example, where a court of twenty-three was convened to judge capital law, was disbanded, and said to them: At least adjudicate for me the monetary law,
llm_translation: Rava said: The people of the world are not concerned with the Aramaic language, yet here we are concerned for the honor of the earlier sages. And here, what are we dealing with? For example, when he would wave twenty-three bundles of myrtle branches for the laws of the souls, and they were lost, and he said to them: "Decide for me the laws of monetary matters."

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים, תְּבָעוֹ מָמוֹן – בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה, תְּבָעוֹ נְפָשׁוֹת – בְּעֶשְׂרִים וּשְׁלֹשָׁה. בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרָבָא, תְּבָעוֹ מָמוֹן תְּחִלָּה – בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה, תְּבָעוֹ נְפָשׁוֹת תְּחִלָּה – אֲפִילּוּ מָמוֹן בְּעֶשְׂרִים וּשְׁלֹשָׁה. אֶלָּא לְעוּלָּא קַשְׁיָא!
human_translation: raises an objection And the Rabbis say: claimed money, by three claimed death by twenty-three Granted, to Rava, claimed money at the outset, by three initially claimed death even a financial by twenty-three But to Ulla, difficult.
llm_translation: Challenger: And the sages say, "One who demands money - with three, one who demands lives - with twenty-three." It is well according to Rava, if one first demands money - with three, if one first demands lives - even if it is twenty-three. But according to Ulla, it is difficult!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: אֲנִי וַאֲרִי שֶׁבַּחֲבוּרָה תַּרְגֵּימְנַהּ. וּמַנּוּ? רַב חִיָּיא בַּר אָבִין. הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן? שֶׁהֵבִיא הַבַּעַל עֵדִים שֶׁזִּינְּתָה, וְהֵבִיא הָאָב עֵדִים וֶהֱזִימּוּם לְעֵדֵי הַבַּעַל. בָּא לִגְבּוֹת מָמוֹן מִבַּעַל – בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה, וּבִמְקוֹם נְפָשׁוֹת – בְּעֶשְׂרִים וּשְׁלֹשָׁה.
human_translation: Rava said: I and the lion of the group explained And who is Rav Ḥiyya bar Avin. With what are we dealing here? where the husband brought witnesses that committed adultery, and the father brought witnesses, and classified the husband’s witnesses conspiring witnesses. comes to collect monetary restitution from the husband by three And in capital punishment, by twenty-three
llm_translation: Rava said: I and Aryeh in the group will translate it. And who are they? Rav Chiya bar Avin. What are we dealing with here? The husband brought witnesses that she committed adultery, and the father brought witnesses and they were made witnesses for the husband. If he comes to collect money from the husband - with three, and in place of his life - with twenty-three.

hebrew_text: אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא חָיְישִׁינַן לְלַעַז, וּמִשּׁוּם כְּבוֹדָן שֶׁל רִאשׁוֹנִים. הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן? כְּגוֹן דְּאַתְרוֹ בַּהּ סְתָם.
human_translation: Abaye said: everyone, concerned for rumors, and for the honor of the first here we are dealing with where warned her without specification
llm_translation: Abaye said: Throughout the world, we are concerned for the language, due to the honor of the early sages. What are we dealing with here? For example, when they found it in a random place.

hebrew_text: וְהַאי תַּנָּא הוּא, דְּתַנְיָא: וּשְׁאָר כׇּל חַיָּיבֵי מִיתוֹת שֶׁבַּתּוֹרָה, אֵין מְמִיתִין אוֹתָם אֶלָּא בְּעֵדָה וְעֵדִים וְהַתְרָאָה, וְעַד שֶׁיּוֹדִיעוּהוּ שֶׁהוּא חַיָּיב מִיתָה בְּבֵית דִּין.
human_translation: And is this tanna , As it is taught all the others, liable for death penalties in the Torah executes them only when The congregation, and witnesses; and forewarning And unless informed that he is liable the death penalty from court.
llm_translation: And this Tanna, he is, as it was taught: And all those liable to death penalties in the Torah, they are not put to death except by a court, witnesses, and warning, until they inform him that he is liable to death by the court.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: עַד שֶׁיּוֹדִיעוּהוּ בְּאֵיזֹה מִיתָה הוּא נֶהֱרָג.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: unless informed by which death he is killed.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: Until they inform him in which death he is to be killed.

hebrew_text: רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר: הָכָא בְּאִשָּׁה חֲבֵירָה עָסְקִינַן, וְקָמִיפַּלְגִי בִּפְלוּגְתָּא דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר יְהוּדָה וְרַבָּנַן. דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: חָבֵר אֵין צָרִיךְ הַתְרָאָה, לְפִי שֶׁלֹּא נִיתְּנָה הַתְרָאָה אֶלָּא לְהַבְחִין בֵּין שׁוֹגֵג לְמֵזִיד.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said Here we are dealing with a woman a ḥaveira , And they disagree with regard to the dispute between Rabbi Yosei bar Yehuda and the Rabbis. As it is taught Rabbi Yosei bar Yehuda says: A ḥaver , does not need a forewarning because forewarning is given only to distinguish between unintentional and intentional
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: Here we are dealing with a case involving a woman, and they argue in the dispute of Rabbi Yosei bar Yehuda and the Rabbis. As it was taught: Rabbi Yosei bar Yehuda says: A friend does not require warning, because warning was only given to distinguish between unintentional and intentional sin.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: כְּגוֹן
human_translation: Rav Ashi says where
llm_translation: Rav Ashei said: "Such as..."

hebrew_text: דְּאַתְרוֹ בַּיהּ מַלְקוֹת, וְלָא אַתְרוֹ בַּיהּ קַטְלָא.
human_translation: warned her lashes, but did not warn her death
llm_translation: In its place they found lashes, but in its place they did not find death.

hebrew_text: וְקָמִיפַּלְגִי בִּפְלוּגְתָּא דְּרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל וְרַבָּנַן, דִּתְנַן: מַכּוֹת בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה. מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל אָמְרוּ: בְּעֶשְׂרִים וּשְׁלֹשָׁה.
human_translation: And they disagree with regard to the dispute between Rabbi Yishmael and the Rabbis, as we learned lashes by three In the name of Rabbi Yishmael was stated: by twenty-three
llm_translation: And they argued in the dispute of Rabbi Yishmael and the Rabbis, as we learned: "Stripes in three." In the name of Rabbi Yishmael they said: "With twenty-three."

hebrew_text: רָבִינָא אָמַר: כְּגוֹן שֶׁנִּמְצָא אֶחָד מִן הָעֵדִים קָרוֹב אוֹ פָּסוּל, וְקָמִיפַּלְגִי בִּפְלוּגְתָּא דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי וְרַבִּי, אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא. דִּתְנַן: רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר, לֹא בָּא שְׁלִישִׁי אֶלָּא לְהַחְמִיר עָלָיו, לַעֲשׂוֹת דִּינוֹ כַּיּוֹצֵא בָּאֵלּוּ.
human_translation: Ravina says where one of the witnesses is found relative or a disqualified And disagree with regard to the dispute between Rabbi Yosei and Rabbi with regard to Rabbi Akiva. As we learned Rabbi Akiva says: the third only to be stringent with him, to make his status like these
llm_translation: Ravinah said: For example, if one of the witnesses is found to be close or disqualified, and he disagrees with the opinion of Rabbi Yosei and Rabbi in the matter of Rabbi Akiva, as we learned: Rabbi Akiva says, the third one only comes to be stringent upon him, to rule his case in accordance with these.

hebrew_text: אִם כֵּן עָנַשׁ הַכָּתוּב אֶת הַנִּיטְפָּל לְעוֹבְרֵי עֲבֵירָה כְּעוֹבְרֵי עֲבֵירָה – עַל אַחַת כַּמָּה וְכַמָּה שֶׁיְּשַׁלֵּם שָׂכָר לַנִּיטְפָּל לְעוֹשֵׂה מִצְוָה כְּעוֹשֵׂה מִצְוָה.
human_translation: If so, the Torah punishes an accessory to transgressors as the transgressors. All the more so, will grant the reward to an accessory to performs a mitzva like one who performs a mitzva,
llm_translation: If so, the Scripture punished the one who was passive in sin like the one who was active in sin - how much more so should the reward be paid to the one who is passive in fulfilling a commandment like the one who is active in fulfilling a commandment.

hebrew_text: וּמָה שְׁנַיִם, נִמְצָא אֶחָד מֵהֶן קָרוֹב אוֹ פָּסוּל – עֵדוּתָן בְּטֵלָה, אַף שְׁלֹשָׁה, נִמְצָא אֶחָד מֵהֶן קָרוֹב אוֹ פָּסוּל – עֵדוּתָן בְּטֵלָה. וּמִנַּיִין שֶׁאֲפִילּוּ מֵאָה? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״עֵדִים״.
human_translation: just as two one of them is found relative or a disqualified their testimony is nullified, so too, three one of them is found relative or a disqualified their testimony is nullified. And from where that even one hundred The verse states: “Witnesses.”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And what if two, one of them is found to be close or disqualified - their testimony is nullified, even three, one of them is found to be close or disqualified - their testimony is nullified. And from where do we derive that even a hundred? The Scripture teaches: "witnesses."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים? בְּדִינֵי נְפָשׁוֹת, אֲבָל בְּדִינֵי מָמוֹנוֹת תִּתְקַיֵּים עֵדוּת בַּשְּׁאָר. רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: אֶחָד דִּינֵי מָמוֹנוֹת וְאֶחָד דִּינֵי נְפָשׁוֹת, וְאֵימָתַי? בִּזְמַן שֶׁהִתְרוּ בָּהֶן, אֲבָל בִּזְמַן שֶׁלֹּא הִתְרוּ בָּהֶן,
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: In what is this statement, said? In capital law. But in monetary law, the testimony upheld with the other Rabbi says: both monetary law and capital law. And when When warned but when did not warn
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei said: In what are these matters said? In matters of capital cases, but in matters of monetary cases, testimony is established with other witnesses. Rabbi says: The laws of monetary cases are the same as the laws of capital cases, and when is this so? When they were permitted in them, but when they were not permitted in them,

hebrew_text: מָה יַעֲשׂוּ שְׁנֵי אַחִים וְאֶחָד, שֶׁרָאוּ בְּאֶחָד שֶׁהָרַג אֶת הַנֶּפֶשׁ?
human_translation: what two brothers and one do, saw someone kill person?
llm_translation: What should two brothers and one other do, who saw that one killed a soul?

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: כְּגוֹן שֶׁהִתְרוּ בָּהּ אֲחֵרִים, וְלֹא הִתְרוּ בָּהּ עֵדִים. וְקָמִיפַּלְגִי בִּפְלוּגְתָּא דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי וְרַבָּנַן, דִּתְנַן: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר, לְעוֹלָם אֵינוֹ נֶהֱרָג עַד שֶׁיְּהוּ פִּי שְׁנֵי עֵדָיו מַתְרִין בּוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״עַל פִּי שְׁנַיִם עֵדִים״.
human_translation: And if you wish, say where others warned her, and witnesses did not warn her. And disagree with regard to the dispute between Rabbi Yosei and the Rabbis. As we learned Rabbi Yosei says: never executed unless the mouths of his two witnesses warn him, as it is stated: “At the mouth of two witnesses,
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: For example, if others permitted her, but witnesses did not permit her. And they argue in the dispute of Rabbi Yosei and the Rabbis, as we learned: Rabbi Yosei says, one is never executed until the mouths of his two witnesses are opened against him, as it is stated: "By the mouth of two witnesses."

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: כְּגוֹן דְּאִיתַּכְחוּשׁ בִּבְדִיקוֹת, וְלָא אִיתַּכְחוּשׁ בַּחֲקִירוֹת.
human_translation: And if you wish, say where was found to be contradictory with regard to examinations but was not found to be contradictory with regard to interrogations
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: For example, that they were diligent in examinations, but not diligent in investigations.

hebrew_text: וְקָמִיפַּלְגִי בִּפְלוּגְתָּא דְּבֶן זַכַּאי וְרַבָּנַן, דִּתְנַן: מַעֲשֶׂה וּבָדַק בֶּן זַכַּאי בְּעוּקְצֵי תְאֵנִים.
human_translation: And disagree with regard to the dispute between ben Zakkai and the Rabbis. As we learned An incident and ben Zakkai examined with regard to the stems of figs,
llm_translation: And he argued in the dispute between Ben Zakkai and the Rabbis, as we learned: Ben Zakkai examined the clusters of figs.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: הֵבִיא הַבַּעַל עֵדִים שֶׁזִּינְּתָה, וְהֵבִיא הָאָב עֵדִים וֶהֱזִימּוּם לְעֵדֵי הַבַּעַל, עֵדֵי הַבַּעַל נֶהֱרָגִין וְאֵין מְשַׁלְּמִין מָמוֹן.
human_translation: Rav Yosef says: husband brought witnesses that committed adultery, and the father brought witnesses, and testified that the husband’s witnesses were conspiring witnesses, the husband’s witnesses are executed, but do not pay money.
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: The husband brought witnesses that she committed adultery, and the father brought witnesses and they conspired against the husband's witnesses, the husband's witnesses are put to death and they do not pay monetary compensation.

hebrew_text: חָזַר וְהֵבִיא הַבַּעַל עֵדִים, וֶהֱזִימּוּם לְעֵדֵי הָאָב. עֵדֵי הָאָב נֶהֱרָגִין, וּמְשַׁלְּמִין מָמוֹן. מָמוֹן לָזֶה, וּנְפָשׁוֹת לָזֶה.
human_translation: the husband came back and brought witnesses, and testified that the father’s witnesses were conspiring witnesses, the father’s witnesses are executed, and they pay money money for this and lives for that
llm_translation: He returned and brought the husband of witnesses, and they conspired against the witnesses of the father. The witnesses of the father are killed, and they pay money. Money for this one, and lives for this one.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: ״פְּלוֹנִי רְבָעוֹ לְאוֹנְסוֹ״ – הוּא וְאַחֵר מִצְטָרְפִין לְהׇרְגוֹ.
human_translation: And Rav Yosef says, so-and-so sodomized him against his will, he and another combine to kill
llm_translation: And Rav Yosef said: "So-and-so owes a quarter to his creditor" - he and another join together to kill him.

hebrew_text: ״לִרְצוֹנוֹ״ – רָשָׁע הוּא, וְהַתּוֹרָה אָמְרָה: ״אַל תָּשֶׁת רָשָׁע עֵד״. רָבָא אָמַר: אָדָם קָרוֹב אֵצֶל עַצְמוֹ, וְאֵין אָדָם מֵשִׂים עַצְמוֹ רָשָׁע.
human_translation: with his consent, he wicked, and the Torah said: “Do not put a wicked witness” Rava says: A person is his own relative and a person cannot render himself wicked
llm_translation: "To his desire" - he is wicked, and the Torah said: "Do not place a wicked person as a witness." Rava said: A person is close to himself, and a person does not consider himself wicked.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא:
human_translation: Rava says:
llm_translation: Rava said:

hebrew_text: ״פְּלוֹנִי בָּא עַל אִשְׁתִּי״, הוּא וְאַחֵר מִצְטָרְפִין לְהוֹרְגוֹ, אֲבָל לֹא לְהוֹרְגָהּ.
human_translation: So-and-so engaged in intercourse with my wife, he and another combine to execute him, but not to execute her.
llm_translation: "Ploni came upon my wife," he and another join together to kill him, but not to kill her.

hebrew_text: מַאי קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן? דִּמְפַלְּגִינַן בְּדִיבּוּרָא? הַיְינוּ הָךְ! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: אָדָם קָרוֹב אֵצֶל עַצְמוֹ – אָמְרִינַן, אֵצֶל אִשְׁתּוֹ – לָא אָמְרִינַן. קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: What teaching us? that we divide the statement this that lest you say: a person is his own relative, we say with regard to his wife, we do not say teaches us
llm_translation: What is it teaching us? That we differentiate in speech? That is so! What might you say: A person is close to himself - we say, close to his wife - we do not say. It is teaching us.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רָבָא: ״פְּלוֹנִי בָּא עַל נַעֲרָה הַמְאוֹרָסָה״, וְהוּזַּמּוּ – נֶהֱרָגִין, וְאֵין מְשַׁלְּמִין מָמוֹן. ״בִּתּוֹ שֶׁל פְּלוֹנִי״, וְהוּזַּמּוּ – נֶהֱרָגִין וּמְשַׁלְּמִין מָמוֹן. מָמוֹן לָזֶה וּנְפָשׁוֹת לָזֶה.
human_translation: And Rava says: So-and-so engaged in intercourse with a betrothed young woman and they were rendered conspiring witnesses, they are executed, and they are not pay money. the daughter of so-and-so, and they are rendered conspiring witnesses, they are executed, and they pay money. money for this and lives for that
llm_translation: And Rava said: "So-and-so came upon a betrothed maiden," and they were scheming - they are killed, and they do not pay monetary compensation. "The daughter of So-and-so," and they were scheming - they are killed and pay monetary compensation. Money to this one and lives to this one.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רָבָא: ״פְּלוֹנִי רָבַע הַשּׁוֹר״ וְהוּזַּמּוּ – נֶהֱרָגִין, וְאֵין מְשַׁלְּמִין מָמוֹן. ״שׁוֹרוֹ שֶׁל פְּלוֹנִי״ וְהוּזַּמּוּ – נֶהֱרָגִין, וּמְשַׁלְּמִין מָמוֹן. מָמוֹן לָזֶה, וּנְפָשׁוֹת לָזֶה.
human_translation: And Rava says: So-and-so engaged in bestiality with an ox and they were rendered conspiring witnesses, they are executed, and they are not pay money so-and-so’s ox, and they were rendered conspiring witnesses, they are executed, and they pay money money for this and lives for that
llm_translation: And Rava said: "So-and-so's ox gored and was declared a habitual gorer - it shall be killed, and no compensation is paid. 'The ox of So-and-so' gored and was declared a habitual gorer - it shall be killed, and compensation is paid. Compensation to this one, and lives to that one."

hebrew_text: הָא תּוּ לְמָה לִי? הַיְינוּ הָךְ! מִשּׁוּם דְּקָא בָעֵי בַּעְיָא עִילָּוֵיהּ, דְּבָעֵי רָבָא: ״פְּלוֹנִי רָבַע שׁוֹרִי״, מַהוּ? מִי אָמְרִינַן: אָדָם קָרוֹב אֵצֶל עַצְמוֹ, וְאֵין אָדָם קָרוֹב אֵצֶל מָמוֹנוֹ? אוֹ דִילְמָא אָמְרִינַן: אָדָם קָרוֹב אֵצֶל מָמוֹנוֹ? בָּתַר דְּבַעְיַאּ הֲדַר פַּשְׁטַהּ: אָדָם קָרוֹב אֵצֶל עַצְמוֹ, וְאֵין אָדָם קָרוֹב אֵצֶל מָמוֹנוֹ.
human_translation: Why do I also this This that. because raised a dilemma about it, as Rava raised a dilemma: So-and-so engaged in bestiality with my ox, what is Do we say: A person is his own relative but a person does not have the status of a relative with regard to his property, Or perhaps we say: A person has the status of a relative with regard to his property, After raised he then resolved it: A person is his own relative, but a person does not have the status of a relative with regard to his property,
llm_translation: This one, why do I need it? That is it! Because he wants to ask a question about it, as Rava asks: "So-and-so, a quarter of my ox," what is the law? Do we say: A person is closer to himself, and a person is not closer to his money? Or perhaps do we say: A person is closer to his money? After he asked the question, he resolved it: A person is closer to himself, and a person is not closer to his money.

hebrew_text: מַכּוֹת בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה כּוּ׳. מְנָהָנֵי מִילֵּי? אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: אָמַר קְרָא ״וּשְׁפָטוּם״ – שְׁנַיִם, וְאֵין בֵּית דִּין שָׁקוּל, מוֹסִיפִין עֲלֵיהֶם עוֹד אֶחָד. הֲרֵי כָּאן שְׁלֹשָׁה.
human_translation: lashes by three From where is this matter Rav Huna says: The verse states: “And judge them,” two And a court may not an even adds to them one more, there are three here.
llm_translation: Stripes with three. What are the pleasant things? Rav Huna said: The verse says "And they shall judge them" - two, and the court is not balanced, they add one more on them. Here are three.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, ״וְהִצְדִּיקוּ״ – שְׁנַיִם, ״וְהִרְשִׁיעוּ״ – שְׁנַיִם, הֲרֵי כָּאן שִׁבְעָה? הָהוּא מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ כִּדְעוּלָּא, דְּאָמַר עוּלָּא: רֶמֶז לְעֵדִים זוֹמְמִין מִן הַתּוֹרָה מִנַּיִן?
