human_translation: If that is so, “And they shall justify,” two, “And they shall condemn,” two, there seven here. requires that in accordance with of Ulla, as Ulla says: From where in the Torah an allusion to conspiring witnesses?
llm_translation: Rather from now on, "and they shall justify" - two, "and they shall condemn" - two, here are seven? That one asked him as usual, as Ulla said: A hint for conspiring witnesses from the Torah, where is it derived from?

hebrew_text: רֶמֶז לְעֵדִים זוֹמְמִין?! וְהָא כְּתִיב: ״כַּאֲשֶׁר זָמַם״! אֶלָּא, רֶמֶז לְעֵדִים זוֹמְמִין שֶׁלּוֹקִין מִנַּיִין? דִּכְתִיב: ״וְהִצְדִּיקוּ אֶת הַצַּדִּיק וְהִרְשִׁיעוּ אֶת הָרָשָׁע״.
human_translation: An allusion to conspiring witnesses? But it is written as he had planned Rather, From where an allusion to conspiring witnesses are flogged? As it is written: “And they shall justify the just, and they shall condemn the wicked.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: A hint for conspiring witnesses?! But isn't it written: "As he conspired"! Rather, a hint for conspiring witnesses that they are to be interrogated from where? As it is written: "And they shall justify the righteous and condemn the wicked." English translation: A hint for conspiring witnesses?! But isn't it written: "As he conspired"! Rather, a hint for conspiring witnesses that they are to be interrogated from where? As it is written: "And they shall justify the righteous and condemn the wicked."

hebrew_text: מִשּׁוּם דְּ״הִצְדִּיקוּ אֶת הַצַּדִּיק וְהִרְשִׁיעוּ אֶת הָרָשָׁע״, ״וְהָיָה אִם בִּן הַכּוֹת הָרָשָׁע״? אֶלָּא, עֵדִים שֶׁהִרְשִׁיעוּ אֶת הַצַּדִּיק, וַאֲתוֹ עֵדֵי אַחֲרִינֵי וְהִצְדִּיקוּ אֶת הַצַּדִּיק דְּמֵעִיקָּרָא, וְשַׁוִּינְהוּ לְהָנָךְ רְשָׁעִים, ״וְהָיָה אִם בִּן הַכּוֹת הָרָשָׁע״.
human_translation: Due to that “They shall justify the just, and they shall condemn the wicked” “Then it shall be, if the wicked man deserves to be beaten”? Rather, witnesses condemned the just and other witnesses came and justified the the just from the beginning and rendered these wicked, “Then it shall be, if the wicked man deserves to be beaten,
llm_translation: From the fact that "they will justify the righteous and condemn the wicked," "and if the son of the lashes is wicked"? Rather, witnesses who condemned the righteous, and other witnesses came and justified the righteous from the outset, and they were compared to those who find pleasure in wickedness, "and if the son of the lashes is wicked."

hebrew_text: וְתִיפּוֹק לֵיהּ מִ״לֹּא תַעֲנֶה״! מִשּׁוּם דְּהָוֵה לֵיהּ לָאו שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ מַעֲשֶׂה, וְכׇל לָאו שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ מַעֲשֶׂה אֵין לוֹקִין עָלָיו.
human_translation: But derive from “You shall not testify because it is a prohibition that does not involve an action, and any prohibition that does not involve an action, is not flogged for it.
llm_translation: And it should emerge for him "from 'do not answer'!" because it is not a prohibition that involves an action, and any prohibition that does not involve an action, one is not liable for it.

hebrew_text: מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל אָמְרוּ: בְּעֶשְׂרִים וּשְׁלֹשָׁה. מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל? אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: אָתְיָא ״רָשָׁע״ ״רָשָׁע״ מֵחַיָּיבֵי מִיתוֹת. כְּתִיב הָכָא: ״וְהָיָה אִם בִּן הַכּוֹת הָרָשָׁע״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם: ״אֲשֶׁר הוּא רָשָׁע לָמוּת״. מָה לְהַלָּן בְּעֶשְׂרִים וּשְׁלֹשָׁה, אַף כָּאן בְּעֶשְׂרִים וּשְׁלֹשָׁה.
human_translation: was stated in the name of Rabbi Yishmael: by twenty-three What is the reasoning of Rabbi Yishmael? Abaye said: is derived wicked wicked, from liable death It is written here, “Then it shall be, if the wicked man deserves to be beaten,” and it is written there, “That is a wicked man guilty of death” Just as there, by twenty-three so too here, by twenty-three
llm_translation: Talmudic text: On account of Rabbi Yishmael they said: In twenty-three. What is the reason of Rabbi Yishmael? Abaye said: It comes from "wicked" "wicked" liable to death. It is written here: "And if the son of the stripes be wicked," and it is written there: "That he is wicked to die." Just as there, in twenty-three, so too here in twenty-three.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: מַלְקוֹת בִּמְקוֹם מִיתָה עוֹמֶדֶת. אָמַר רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרָבָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: אִי הָכִי, אוּמְדָּנָא לְמָה לִי? לִמְחֲיֵיהּ, וְאִי מָאֵית – לֵימוּת!
human_translation: Rava says: lashes stand in place of execution. Rav Aḥa, son of Rava, said to Rav Ashi: If so, why do I an assessment? Let strike him, and if dies, let him die.
llm_translation: Rava said: Striking in place of death stands. Rav Acha, son of Rava, said to Rav Ashe: If so, why do I need a staff? To revive him, and if not – let him die!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אָמַר קְרָא: ״וְנִקְלָה אָחִיךָ לְעֵינֶיךָ״ – כִּי מָחֵית, אַגַּבָּא דְּחָיֵי מָחֵית. אֶלָּא הָא דְּתַנְיָא: אֲמָדוּהוּ לְקַבֵּל עֶשְׂרִים – אֵין מַכִּין אוֹתוֹ אֶלָּא מַכּוֹת הָרְאוּיוֹת לְהִשְׁתַּלֵּשׁ. וְכַמָּה הֵן? תַּמְנֵי סְרֵי,
human_translation: said to The verse states: “Then your brother will be dishonored before your eyes” when you strike, you strike upon the back of a live But that which is taught assessed him to absorb twenty they flog him only lashes that can be divided into threes, And how many are they? Eighteen.
llm_translation: He said to him: The verse says, "And your brother shall be degraded in your eyes" - because you have degraded him, in the place where you have degraded him. Rather, as it was taught: If one is accustomed to receive twenty lashes - he is not given lashes except lashes suitable for healing. And how many are they? Forty less one.

hebrew_text: לִמְחֲיֵיהּ עֶשְׂרִים וַחֲדָא, וְכִי מָיֵית בְּהָךְ חֲדָא – לֵימוּת, דְּהָא כִּי מָחֵי אַגַּבָּא דְּחַיָּיא קָא מָחֵי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אָמַר קְרָא ״וְנִקְלָה אָחִיךָ לְעֵינֶיךָ״ – אַחַר שֶׁלָּקָה, ״אָחִיךָ״ בָּעֵינָא, וְלֵיכָּא.
human_translation: Let strike him twenty-one and if he dies with this one, let him die. as when strikes upon the back of a living man is striking. said to him: The verse states: “Then your brother will be dishonored before your eyes.” after he is hit, I need your brother; and is no
llm_translation: To keep him alive twenty-one, and if he dies in that one - he shall die, for when he keeps alive on account of the one who is alive, he keeps alive. He said to him: The verse says, "And your brother shall be degraded in your eyes" - after he was degraded, "your brother" I need, and it is not here.

hebrew_text: עִיבּוּר הַחֹדֶשׁ בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה. חִישּׁוּב לָא קָתָנֵי, קִידּוּשׁ לָא קָתָנֵי, אֶלָּא עִיבּוּר. לָא לִיקַדְּשֵׁיהּ, וּמִמֵּילָא לִעַבַּר?
human_translation: intercalation of the month by three does not teach: calculation does not teach: sanctification rather, intercalation do not sanctify and be intercalated by itself.
llm_translation: Interpretation of the new moon with three. Calculation is not taught, sanctification is not taught, rather interpretation. Not to sanctify it, and from when to pass?

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: תְּנִי קִידּוּשׁ הַחֹדֶשׁ. תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: קִידּוּשׁ הַחֹדֶשׁ וְעִיבּוּר הַשָּׁנָה בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. אָמַר רָבָא: וְהָא ״עִיבּוּר״ קָתָנֵי! אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: קִידּוּשׁ בְּיוֹם עִיבּוּר בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה, אַחַר עִיבּוּר לֵיכָּא קִידּוּשׁ.
human_translation: Abaye said: teach: The sanctification of the month This is also taught The sanctification of the month and the intercalation of the year by three the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rava said But teaches: Intercalation, Rather, Rava said: sanctification on the day intercalation, by three after intercalation, there is no sanctification
llm_translation: Abaye said: Teach the sanctification of the month. It was taught in a Baraita likewise: The sanctification of the month and the intercalation of the year are done by three judges, the words of Rabbi Meir. Rava said: But doesn't it teach "intercalation"? Rather, Rava said: Sanctification is done on the day of intercalation by three judges, after intercalation there is no sanctification.

hebrew_text: וּמַנִּי? רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן צָדוֹק הִיא. דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן צָדוֹק אוֹמֵר: אִם לֹא נִרְאָה בִּזְמַנּוֹ – אֵין מְקַדְּשִׁין אוֹתוֹ, שֶׁכְּבָר קִידְּשׁוּהוּ בַּשָּׁמַיִם.
human_translation: And whose It is Rabbi Elazar ben Tzadok, as it is taught Rabbi Elazar ben Tzadok says: If was not seen at its time, does not sanctify as in Heaven has already sanctified it,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And who is it? Rabbi Elazar ben Tzadok. As it was taught, Rabbi Elazar ben Tzadok says: If it does not appear in its time - we do not sanctify it, for it has already been sanctified in heaven.

hebrew_text: רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר: קִידּוּשׁ אַחַר עִיבּוּר – בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה, בְּיוֹם עִיבּוּר – לֵיכָּא קִידּוּשׁ. וּמַנִּי? פְּלֵימוֹ הִיא, דְּתַנְיָא, פְּלֵימוֹ אוֹמֵר: בִּזְמַנּוֹ – אֵין מְקַדְּשִׁין אוֹתוֹ, שֶׁלֹּא בִּזְמַנּוֹ – מְקַדְּשִׁין אוֹתוֹ.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman says: sanctification after intercalation by three on the day of the intercalation, there is no sanctification. And whose It is Peleimu, as it is taught Peleimu says: at its time, does not sanctify not at its time, sanctifies
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said: Kiddush after nightfall - with three, on the day of nightfall - there is no Kiddush. And from where? It is a dispute, as it was taught, Plimo says: in its proper time - we do not sanctify it, not in its proper time - we sanctify it.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: לְעוֹלָם חִישּׁוּב קָתָנֵי, וּמַאי עִיבּוּר? חִישּׁוּב דְּעִיבּוּר. וְאַיְּדֵי דְּקָבָעֵי לְמִיתְנֵי עִיבּוּר שָׁנָה, תְּנָא נָמֵי עִיבּוּר חוֹדֶשׁ.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: Actually, teaches calculation And what Intercalation, the calculation of the intercalation. And Since needed to teach the intercalation of the year, also taught: The intercalation of the month,
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: Always prioritize the smaller calculation, and what is the explanation? The calculation of the explanation. And since they established to teach the explanation for a year, the Mishna also states that the explanation is a month.

hebrew_text: חִישּׁוּב חוֹדֶשׁ – אִין, קִידּוּשׁ חוֹדֶשׁ – לָא. מַנִּי? רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר הִיא, דְּתַנְיָא: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר, בֵּין בִּזְמַנּוֹ בֵּין שֶׁלֹּא בִּזְמַנּוֹ אֵין מְקַדְּשִׁין אוֹתוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְקִדַּשְׁתֶּם אֵת שְׁנַת הַחֲמִשִּׁים שָׁנָה״. שָׁנִים אַתָּה מְקַדֵּשׁ, וְאִי אַתָּה מְקַדֵּשׁ חֳדָשִׁים.
human_translation: the calculation of the month, yes, sanctification of month, not whose It is Rabbi Eliezer. As it is taught Rabbi Eliezer says: Whether in its time whether not in its time, we do not sanctify as it is stated: “And you shall sanctify the fiftieth year” You sanctify years, but you do not sanctify months,
llm_translation: The calculation of the month - no, the sanctification of the month - no. What is the reason? It is Rabbi Eliezer, as it was taught: Rabbi Eliezer says, whether it is in its proper time or not in its proper time, we do not sanctify it, as it is stated: "And you shall sanctify the fiftieth year." Years you sanctify, but you do not sanctify months.

hebrew_text: רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה כּוּ׳. תַּנְיָא: כֵּיצַד אָמַר רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל? בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה מַתְחִילִין, וּבַחֲמִשָּׁה נוֹשְׂאִין וְנוֹתְנִין, וְגוֹמְרִין בְּשִׁבְעָה. אֶחָד אוֹמֵר לֵישֵׁב, וּשְׁנַיִם אוֹמְרִים שֶׁלֹּא לֵישֵׁב – בָּטֵל יָחִיד בְּמִיעוּטוֹ.
human_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says with three It is taught How does Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel say begins with three and debate with five, and conclude with seven. one says to sit and two say that not to sit the single is negated in its minority,
llm_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: "With three people." It was taught: How did Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel say? With three, they begin, and with five, they carry and exchange, and they conclude with seven. One says to sit, and two say not to sit - the individual opinion is nullified in its minority.

hebrew_text: שְׁנַיִם אוֹמְרִים לֵישֵׁב, וְאֶחָד אוֹמֵר שֶׁלֹּא לֵישֵׁב – מוֹסִיפִין עֲלֵיהֶם עוֹד שְׁנַיִם, וְנוֹשְׂאִין וְנוֹתְנִין בַּדָּבָר. שְׁנַיִם אוֹמְרִים צְרִיכָה, וּשְׁלֹשָׁה אוֹמְרִים אֵינָהּ צְרִיכָה – בָּטְלוּ שְׁנַיִם בְּמִיעוּטָן. שְׁלֹשָׁה אוֹמְרִים צְרִיכָה, וּשְׁנַיִם אוֹמְרִים אֵינָהּ צְרִיכָה – מוֹסִיפִין עֲלֵיהֶם עוֹד שְׁנַיִם, שֶׁאֵין הַמִּנְיָן פָּחוֹת מִשִּׁבְעָה.
human_translation: two say to sit and one says not to sit, adds another two to them and debate the matter. two say: needs and three say: does not need the two are negated in their minority. three say: needs and two say: does not need adds to them another two as the quorum not fewer than seven.
llm_translation: Two say to sit, and one says not to sit - we add two more upon them, and engage in discussion. Two say it is necessary, and three say it is not necessary - the two are nullified by their minority. Three say it is necessary, and two say it is not necessary - we add two more upon them, as the count cannot be less than seven.

hebrew_text: הָנֵי שְׁלֹשָׁה חֲמִשָּׁה וְשִׁבְעָה, כְּנֶגֶד מִי? פְּלִיגִי בַּהּ רַבִּי יִצְחָק בַּר נַחְמָנִי וְחַד דְּעִימֵּיהּ, וּמַנּוּ? רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן פַּזִּי. וְאָמְרִי לַהּ: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן פַּזִּי וְחַד דְּעִימֵּיהּ, וּמַנּוּ? רַבִּי יִצְחָק בַּר נַחְמָנִי. חַד אָמַר: כְּנֶגֶד בִּרְכַּת כֹּהֲנִים, וְחַד אָמַר: שְׁלֹשָׁה – כְּנֶגֶד שׁוֹמְרֵי הַסַּף, חֲמִשָּׁה – מֵרוֹאֵי פְּנֵי הַמֶּלֶךְ, שִׁבְעָה – רוֹאֵי פְּנֵי הַמֶּלֶךְ.
human_translation: Corresponding to what these three, five, and seven Rabbi Yitzḥak bar Naḥmani and one who was with him disagree about this. And who is Rabbi Shimon ben Pazi. And some say Rabbi Shimon ben Pazi and one who was with him. And who is Rabbi Yitzḥak bar Naḥmani. One said: correspond to the priestly benediction And one said: Three corresponds to the guards of the door five of saw the king’s face seven saw the king’s face
llm_translation: These three, five, and seven, against whom? Rabbi Yitzchak bar Nachmani and one of his colleagues disagree, and who are they? Rabbi Shimon ben Pazi. And some say: Rabbi Shimon ben Pazi and one of his colleagues, and who are they? Rabbi Yitzchak bar Nachmani. One said: Against the blessing of the priests, and one said: Three - against the guards of the Temple, five - those who see the face of the king, seven - those who see the face of the king.

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי רַב יוֹסֵף: הָנֵי שְׁלֹשָׁה וַחֲמִשָּׁה וְשִׁבְעָה, שְׁלֹשָׁה – כְּנֶגֶד שׁוֹמְרֵי הַסַּף, חֲמִשָּׁה – מֵרוֹאֵי פְּנֵי הַמֶּלֶךְ, שִׁבְעָה – רוֹאֵי פְּנֵי הַמֶּלֶךְ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי לְרַב יוֹסֵף: עַד הָאִידָּנָא מַאי טַעְמָא לָא פָּרֵישׁ לַן מָר הָכִי? אֲמַר לְהוּ: לָא הֲוָה יָדַעְנָא דִּצְרִיכִיתוּ. מִי בְּעֵיתוּ מִנַּאי מִילְּתָא וְלָא אֲמַרִי לְכוּ?
human_translation: Rav Yosef taught These Three, five, and seven Three corresponds to: Guards of the door; five Of who saw the king’s face, seven who saw the king’s face, Abaye said to Rav Yosef: What is the reason until now the Master did not explain to us this way, said to I did not know that you needed Have you asked me something and I did not tell you?
llm_translation: Tanna Rabbi Yosef taught: Those who stand three, five, and seven times a day, three - corresponding to the guards of the palace, five - to those who see the face of the king, seven - to those who see the face of the king. Abaye said to Rav Yosef: Until now, why did our master not explain this to us in this manner? He said to them: We did not know that you needed it. Who asked you about this matter and we did not say to you?

hebrew_text: זְמַן, נָשִׂיא, צָרִיךְ, גְּדִי – סִימָן. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אֵין מְעַבְּרִין אֶת הַשָּׁנָה אֶלָּא
human_translation: a mnemonic Zeman , Nasi , tzarikh , gedi . The Sages taught The year intercalated only
llm_translation: Time, president, needs, goat - sign. The Rabbis taught: One may only pass over the year except

hebrew_text: בִּמְזוּמָּנִין לָהּ. מַעֲשֵׂה בְּרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל שֶׁאָמַר: הַשְׁכִּימוּ לִי שִׁבְעָה לַעֲלִיָּיה. הִשְׁכִּים וּמָצָא שְׁמוֹנָה. אָמַר: מִי הוּא שֶׁעָלָה שֶׁלֹּא בִּרְשׁוּת? יֵרֵד!
human_translation: by who were invited for that an incident involving Rabban Gamliel, who said Bring me seven early to the loft went early and found eight said: Who is it who ascended without permission? He must descend
llm_translation: In designated times for her. It happened with Rabban Gamliel that he said: Prepare for me seven people for the ascent. He prepared and found eight. He said: Who is it that ascended without permission? Descend!

hebrew_text: עָמַד שְׁמוּאֵל הַקָּטָן וְאָמַר: אֲנִי הוּא שֶׁעָלִיתִי שֶׁלֹּא בִּרְשׁוּת, וְלֹא לְעַבֵּר הַשָּׁנָה עָלִיתִי אֶלָּא לִלְמוֹד הֲלָכָה לְמַעֲשֶׂה הוּצְרַכְתִּי. אָמַר לוֹ: שֵׁב בְּנִי, שֵׁב. רְאוּיוֹת כׇּל הַשָּׁנִים כּוּלָּן לְהִתְעַבֵּר עַל יָדֶךָ, אֶלָּא אָמְרוּ חֲכָמִים: אֵין מְעַבְּרִין אֶת הַשָּׁנָה אֶלָּא בַּמְזוּמָּנִין לָהּ. וְלָא שְׁמוּאֵל הַקָּטָן הֲוָה, אֶלָּא אִינִישׁ אַחֲרִינָא, וּמֵחֲמַת כִּיסּוּפָא הוּא דַּעֲבַד.
human_translation: Shmuel HaKatan stood and said: I am he who ascended without permission; and I did not ascend to intercalate the year, but I needed to learn the practical halakha . said to him: Sit, my son, sit. It would be fitting for all of the years to be intercalated by you, But the Sages said: The year intercalated only by who were invited for that And it was not Shmuel HaKatan but another person. And due to the embarrassment did
llm_translation: Samuel the Young stood and said: I am the one who ascended without permission, not to transgress, but only to learn practical Halacha I needed. He said to him: Sit down, my son, sit down. All the years were fitting to pass through you, but the sages said: We only pass the year at its appointed time. And Samuel the Young was not, but another person, and due to his impetuosity he did so.

hebrew_text: כִּי הָא דְּיָתֵיב רַבִּי וְקָא דָרֵישׁ, וְהֵרִיחַ רֵיחַ שׁוּם. אָמַר: מִי שֶׁאָכַל שׁוּם יֵצֵא. עָמַד רַבִּי חִיָּיא וְיָצָא. עָמְדוּ כּוּלָּן וְיָצְאוּ. בַּשַּׁחַר מְצָאוֹ רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בְּרַבִּי לְרַבִּי חִיָּיא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַתָּה הוּא שֶׁצִּיעַרְתָּ לְאַבָּא? אָמַר לוֹ: לֹא תְּהֵא כְּזֹאת בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל!
human_translation: similar when Rabbi sitting and teaching, and smelled the odor of garlic. said: Whoever ate garlic leave. Rabbi Ḥiyya stood up and left. all of those stood up and left. in the morning, Rabbi Shimon, son of Rabbi found Rabbi Ḥiyya, said to him: you the one who disturbed my father said to him: There should not be such among the Jewish people.
llm_translation: The one where Rabbi was sitting and expounding, and he smelled garlic. He said: "Whoever ate garlic should leave." Rabbi Chiya stood up and left. They all stood up and left. In the morning, Rabbi Shimon, son of Rabbi, found Rabbi Chiya. He said to him: "Did you offend my father?" He replied: "May it not be so in Israel!"

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי חִיָּיא מֵהֵיכָא גְּמִיר לַהּ? מֵרַבִּי מֵאִיר, דְּתַנְיָא: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּאִשָּׁה אַחַת שֶׁבָּאתָה לְבֵית מִדְרָשׁוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי מֵאִיר. אָמְרָה לוֹ: רַבִּי, אֶחָד מִכֶּם קִדְּשַׁנִי בְּבִיאָה. עָמַד רַבִּי מֵאִיר וְכָתַב לָהּ גֵּט כְּרִיתוּת וְנָתַן לָהּ. עָמְדוּ כָּתְבוּ כּוּלָּם וְנָתְנוּ לָהּ.
human_translation: And from where did Rabbi Ḥiyya learn that from Rabbi Meir, as it is taught an incident involving woman who came to the study hall of Rabbi Meir. She said to him: My teacher, one of you, betrothed me through intercourse. Rabbi Meir arose and wrote her a bill of divorce, and gave it to her. all those arose wrote and gave to her.
llm_translation: Rabbi Chiya, from where did he learn it? From Rabbi Meir, as it was taught: There was an incident with a certain woman who came to the study hall of Rabbi Meir. She said to him: Rabbi, one of you has consecrated me through intercourse. Rabbi Meir stood up, wrote for her a bill of divorce, and gave it to her. They all stood up, wrote it, and gave it to her.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי מֵאִיר מֵהֵיכָא גְּמִיר לַהּ? מִשְּׁמוּאֵל הַקָּטָן. וּשְׁמוּאֵל הַקָּטָן מֵהֵיכָא גְּמִיר לַהּ? מִשְּׁכַנְיָה בֶן יְחִיאֵל, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיַּעַן שְׁכַנְיָה בֶן יְחִיאֵל מִבְּנֵי עֵילָם וַיֹּאמֶר לְעֶזְרָא אֲנַחְנוּ מָעַלְנוּ בֵאלֹהֵינוּ וַנֹּשֶׁב נָשִׁים נׇכְרִיּוֹת מֵעַמֵּי הָאָרֶץ וְעַתָּה יֵשׁ מִקְוֶה לְיִשְׂרָאֵל עַל זֹאת״.
human_translation: And from where did Rabbi Meir learn that From Shmuel HaKatan, And from where did Shmuel HaKatan learn it? From Shecaniah ben Jehiel, as it is written: “And Shecaniah, the son of Jehiel, one of the sons of Elam, answered and said to Ezra: We have broken faith with our God, and have married foreign women of the peoples of the land; yet now there is hope for Israel concerning this”
llm_translation: Rabbi Meir, from where did he learn it? From Shmuel HaKatan. And from where did Shmuel HaKatan learn it? From Shechaniah ben Yechiel, as it is written: "Now Shechaniah son of Yechiel, one of the descendants of Elam, addressed Ezra: 'We have been unfaithful to our God by marrying foreign women from the peoples around us. But in spite of this, there is still hope for Israel.'"

hebrew_text: וּשְׁכַנְיָה בֶן יְחִיאֵל מֵהֵיכָא גְּמַר לַהּ? מִיהוֹשֻׁעַ, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיֹּאמֶר ה׳ אֶל יְהוֹשֻׁעַ קֻם לָךְ לָמָּה זֶּה אַתָּה נֹפֵל עַל פָּנֶיךָ חָטָא יִשְׂרָאֵל״. אָמַר לְפָנָיו: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם, מִי חָטָא? אָמַר לוֹ: וְכִי דֵּילָטוֹר אֲנִי? לֵךְ הַטֵּל גּוֹרָלוֹת. וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: מִמֹּשֶׁה, דִּכְתִיב: ״עַד אָנָה מֵאַנְתֶּם״.
human_translation: And from where did Shecaniah ben Jehiel learn it? From Joshua, as it is written: “And the Lord said to Joshua: Get yourself up; why do you fall upon your face? Israel has sinned” said before Him: Master of the Universe, who sinned? said to him: And am I your informer? cast lots And if you wish, say from Moses, as it is written: How long do you refuse
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And Sh'kanyah ben Yechiel from where did he learn? From Yehoshua, as it is written: 'And Hashem said to Yehoshua, 'Rise up! Why do you lie upon your face? Israel has sinned.'' He said before Him: Master of the Universe, who has sinned? He said to him: Am I a detective? Go cast lots. And if you wish, say: From Moshe, as it is written: 'How long will you refuse to keep My commandments and My laws?'"

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מִשֶּׁמֵּתוּ נְבִיאִים הָאַחֲרוֹנִים חַגַּי זְכַרְיָה וּמַלְאָכִי, נִסְתַּלְּקָה רוּחַ הַקּוֹדֶשׁ מִיִּשְׂרָאֵל. וְאַף עַל פִּי כֵן הָיוּ מִשְׁתַּמְּשִׁין בְּבַת קוֹל. פַּעַם אַחַת הָיוּ מְסוּבִּין בַּעֲלִיַּית בֵּית גּוּרְיָה בִּירִיחוֹ, וְנִתְּנָה עֲלֵיהֶם בַּת קוֹל מִן הַשָּׁמַיִם: יֵשׁ כָּאן אֶחָד שֶׁרָאוּי שֶׁתִּשְׁרֶה עָלָיו שְׁכִינָה כְּמֹשֶׁה רַבֵּינוּ, אֶלָּא שֶׁאֵין דּוֹרוֹ זַכַּאי לְכָךְ. נָתְנוּ חֲכָמִים אֶת עֵינֵיהֶם בְּהִלֵּל הַזָּקֵן. וּכְשֶׁמֵּת, אָמְרוּ עָלָיו: הִי חָסִיד, הִי עָנָיו, תַּלְמִידוֹ שֶׁל עֶזְרָא.
human_translation: The Sages taught: After the last of the prophets, Haggai, Zechariah, and Malachi, died, the Divine Spirit departed from the Jewish people. But nevertheless, they were utilizing a Divine Voice, One time, were reclining in the loft of the house of Gurya in Jericho, and a Divine Voice was bestowed upon them from Heaven, There is one here who is fit for the Divine Presence to rest upon him as Moses our teacher, but his generation is not deserving of this The Sages set their eyes upon Hillel the Elder, And when he died, said about him: Alas, pious alas, humble a disciple of Ezra.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: After the death of the later prophets, Haggai, Zechariah, and Malachi, the Holy Spirit departed from Israel. Nevertheless, they still utilized a Bat Kol. Once, they were gathered in the attic of the house of Guria in Jericho, and a Bat Kol came upon them from heaven, saying: "There is one here who is worthy that the Divine Presence should rest upon him like Moses our teacher, but his generation is not deserving of this." The sages directed their attention to Hillel the Elder. And when he passed away, they said of him: "He was pious, humble, a disciple of Ezra."

hebrew_text: שׁוּב פַּעַם אַחַת הָיוּ מְסוּבִּין בַּעֲלִיָּה בְּיַבְנֶה, וְנִתְּנָה עֲלֵיהֶם בַּת קוֹל מִן הַשָּׁמַיִם: יֵשׁ כָּאן אֶחָד שֶׁרָאוּי שֶׁתִּשְׁרֶה עָלָיו שְׁכִינָה, אֶלָּא שֶׁאֵין דּוֹרוֹ זַכַּאי לְכָךְ. נָתְנוּ חֲכָמִים אֶת עֵינֵיהֶם בִּשְׁמוּאֵל הַקָּטָן. וּכְשֶׁמֵּת, אָמְרוּ עָלָיו: הִי חָסִיד, הִי עָנָיו, תַּלְמִידוֹ שֶׁל הִלֵּל. אַף הוּא אָמַר בִּשְׁעַת מִיתָתוֹ: שִׁמְעוֹן וְיִשְׁמָעֵאל לְחַרְבָּא, וְחַבְרוֹהִי לִקְטָלָא, וּשְׁאָר עַמָּא לְבִיזָּא, וְעָקָן סַגִּיאָן עֲתִידָן לְמֵיתֵי עַל עָלְמָא.
human_translation: Another time, were reclining in the loft in Yavne, and a Divine Voice was bestowed upon them from Heaven, There is one here who is fit for the Divine Presence to rest upon him but his generation is not deserving of this The Sages set their eyes upon Shmuel HaKatan. And when died, said about him: Alas, pious alas, humble a disciple of Hillel. Additionally, he said at the time of his death, Shimon and Yishmael, by the sword, and their friends by executions, and the rest of the nation despoiled, and great troubles will ultimately come upon the world.
llm_translation: Return once they were reclining in the upper story in Yavneh, and a heavenly voice came upon them: "There is one here who is fitting for the Divine Presence to rest upon him, but his generation is not deserving of it." The sages directed their eyes towards Shmuel the Little. And when he passed away, they said about him: "He was pious, humble, a disciple of Hillel." He also said at the time of his death: "Shimon and Yishmael are fit for the sword, his colleague for execution, the rest of the people for plunder, and the great sages are destined for the World to Come."

hebrew_text: וְעַל יְהוּדָה בֶּן בָּבָא בִּקְּשׁוּ לוֹמַר כֵּן, אֶלָּא שֶׁנִּטְרְפָה שָׁעָה, שֶׁאֵין מַסְפִּידִין עַל הֲרוּגֵי מַלְכוּת.
human_translation: And wished to say thus: about Yehuda ben Bava, but the hour was torn, as does not eulogize those executed by the government.
llm_translation: And on Judah ben Bava they sought to say so, but it was invalidated for a moment, for we do not eulogize those killed by the kingdom.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אֵין מְעַבְּרִין אֶת הַשָּׁנָה אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן יִרְצֶה נָשִׂיא. וּמַעֲשֶׂה בְּרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל שֶׁהָלַךְ לִיטּוֹל רְשׁוּת אֵצֶל הֶגְמוֹן אֶחָד שֶׁבְּסוּרְיָא, וְשָׁהָה לָבוֹא, וְעִיבְּרוּ אֶת הַשָּׁנָה עַל מְנָת שֶׁיִּרְצֶה רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל. וּכְשֶׁבָּא רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל וְאָמַר ״רוֹצֶה אֲנִי״, נִמְצֵאת שָׁנָה מְעוּבֶּרֶת.
human_translation: The Sages taught: The year intercalated only if the Nasi wants And an incident involving Rabban Gamliel, who went to ask permission from an officer [ hegmon ] in Syria, and tarried in returning And intercalated the year on the condition that Rabban Gamliel would want And when Rabban Gamliel came and said: I want the year was found intercalated.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: One does not intercalate the year unless the Nasi desires it. It once happened with Rabban Gamliel that he went to take permission from a certain elder in Suria, and he delayed in coming, and they intercalated the year so that Rabban Gamliel would be pleased. When Rabban Gamliel arrived and said, "I desire it," it was found that the year had been intercalated.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אֵין מְעַבְּרִין אֶת הַשָּׁנָה אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן הָיְתָה צְרִיכָה, מִפְּנֵי הַדְּרָכִים, וּמִפְּנֵי הַגְּשָׁרִים, וּמִפְּנֵי תַּנּוּרֵי פְסָחִים, וּמִפְּנֵי גָּלִיּוֹת יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁנֶּעֶקְרוּ מִמְּקוֹמָן וַעֲדַיִין לֹא הִגִּיעוּ. אֲבָל לֹא מִפְּנֵי הַשֶּׁלֶג, וְלֹא מִפְּנֵי הַצִּינָּה, וְלֹא מִפְּנֵי גָּלִיּוֹת יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁלֹּא עָקְרוּ מִמְּקוֹמָן.
human_translation: The Sages taught: The year intercalated only if it is necessary due to the roads, or due to the bridges or due to the ovens Paschal offerings or due to the Diaspora Jews who have left their homes and still have not arrived But not due to the snow, and not due to the cold, and not due to the Diaspora Jews who have not left from their homes,
llm_translation: The sages taught: One may not intercalate the year unless there was a need, because of the roads, and because of the bridges, and because of the ovens of Passover, and because of the exiles of Israel who were uprooted from their place and have not yet arrived. But not because of the snow, and not because of the cold, and not because of the exiles of Israel who were not uprooted from their place.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אֵין מְעַבְּרִין אֶת הַשָּׁנָה לֹא מִפְּנֵי הַגְּדָיִים, וְלֹא מִפְּנֵי הַטְּלָאִים, וְלֹא מִפְּנֵי הַגּוֹזָלוֹת שֶׁלֹּא פֵּירְחוּ, אֲבָל עוֹשִׂין אוֹתָן סַעַד לַשָּׁנָה. כֵּיצַד? רַבִּי יַנַּאי אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל: מְהוֹדְעִין אֲנַחְנָא לְכוֹן דְּגוֹזָלַיָּיא רַכִּיכִין, וְאִימְּרַיָּא דַּעְדְּקִין, וְזִימְנָא דַאֲבִיבָא לָא מְטָא, וּשְׁפַרַת מִילְּתָא בְּאַנְפַּאי, וְאוֹסֵיפִית עַל שַׁתָּא דָּא תְּלָתִין יוֹמִין.
human_translation: The Sages taught: The year may not intercalated due to the young goats and not due to the lambs, and not due to the fledgling who have not fly, But these made supporting to the year. How Rabbi Yannai says in the name of Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, We are notifying you that the fledglings are tender, and that the lambs are thin [ de’arkin ], and time for the spring has not arrived. And the matter is good in my eyes, and I have added thirty days onto this year.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: One does not intercalate the year because of the goats, nor because of the lambs, nor because of the young doves that have not yet grown feathers, but they make them a leap year. How so? Rabbi Yannai says in the name of Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel: We, the people of this town, are informed that the young goats are tender, and the lambs are meek, and the time of the ripening of the grain has not yet come, and the matter is clear in our eyes, and we add to this thirty days.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: כַּמָּה עִיבּוּר הַשָּׁנָה? שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: חֹדֶשׁ. אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: רָצוּ – חֹדֶשׁ, רָצוּ – שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם.
human_translation: raises an objection How long is an intercalated year? Thirty days. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: month, Rav Pappa said: wants, month, wants, thirty days.
llm_translation: Challenger: How long is the intercalation of the year? Thirty days. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: A month. Rav Papa said: If they desired - a month, if they desired - thirty days.

hebrew_text: תָּא חֲזִי מַאי אִיכָּא בֵּין
human_translation: Come see what there is between
llm_translation: Come and see, what is the difference between...

hebrew_text: תַּקִּיפֵאי קַדְמָאֵי, לְעִינְוְותָנֵי בָּתְרָאֵי.
human_translation: the earlier, stern and the later, humble
llm_translation: The strong ones of old, to the eyes of the later ones.

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל שֶׁהָיָה יוֹשֵׁב עַל גַּב מַעֲלָה בְּהַר הַבַּיִת, וְהָיָה יוֹחָנָן סוֹפֵר הַלָּז עוֹמֵד לְפָנָיו, וְשָׁלֹשׁ אִיגְּרוֹת חֲתוּכוֹת לְפָנָיו מוּנָּחוֹת.
human_translation: As it is taught an incident involving Rabban Gamliel, who was sitting on a step on the Temple Mount, and Yoḥanan, that scribe, was standing before him, and three documents cut were set before him.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: There was an incident involving Rabban Gamliel who was sitting on the upper step of the Temple Mount, and Yochanan the scribe of the high priest was standing before him, and three folded letters were placed before him.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ: טוֹל אִיגַּרְתָּא חֲדָא וּכְתוֹב: לַאֲחַנָא בְּנֵי גָּלִילָאה עִילָּאָה וְלַאֲחַנָא בְּנֵי גָּלִילָאה תַּתָּאָה, שְׁלוֹמְכוֹן יִסְגֵּא. מְהוֹדְעִין אֲנַחְנָא לְכוֹן דִּזְמַן בִּיעוּרָא מְטָא לְאַפְרוֹשֵׁי מַעְשְׂרָא מִמַּעְטָנָא דְזֵיתָא. וְטוֹל אִיגַּרְתָּא חֲדָא וּכְתוֹב: לַאֲחַנָא בְּנֵי דָרוֹמָא, שְׁלוֹמְכוֹן יִסְגֵּא. מְהוֹדְעִין אֲנַחְנָא לְכוֹן דִּזְמַן בִּיעוּרָא מְטָא לְאַפְרוֹשֵׁי מַעְשְׂרָא מֵעוּמְרֵי שׁוּבְלַיָּא.
human_translation: said to Take one document, and write: To our brothers, the people of the Upper Galilee, and to our brothers, the people of the Lower Galilee, may your peace increase. We are informing you that the time has come eradication to separate the tithe from the vat of olives, And take one document, and write: To our brothers, the people of the South, may your peace increase. We are informing you that the time has come eradication, to separate the tithe from the mounds of stalks
llm_translation: He said to him: Take one letter and write: To the upper Galileans and to the lower Galileans, may your peace increase. We inform you that the time for the selection of the tithe from the small olives has arrived. And take one letter and write: To the southern residents, may your peace increase. We inform you that the time for the selection of the tithe from the bundles of Shublaya has arrived.

hebrew_text: וְטוֹל אִיגַּרְתָּא חֲדָא וּכְתוֹב: לַאֲחַנָא בְּנֵי גָּלְוָותָא בְּבָבֶל, וְלַאֲחַנָא דִּבְמָדַי, וְלִשְׁאָר כֹּל גָּלְווֹתָא דְּיִשְׂרָאֵל, שְׁלוֹמְכוֹן יִסְגֵּא לְעָלַם. מְהוֹדְעִין אֲנַחְנָא לְכוֹן דְּגוֹזָלַיָּא רַכִּיכִין, וְאִימְּרַיָּא דַּעְדְּקִין, וְזִמְנָא דַאֲבִיבָא לָא מְטָא, וּשְׁפַרָא מִילְּתָא בְּאַנְפַּאי וּבְאַנְפֵּי חֲבֵירַיי, וְאוֹסֵיפִית עַל שַׁתָּא דָּא יוֹמִין תְּלָתִין. דִּילְמָא בָּתַר דְּעַבְּרוּהּוֹ.
human_translation: And take one document, and write: To our brothers, the people of the Diaspora in Babylonia, and to our brothers who are in Media, and to the rest of the entire Jewish Diaspora, may your peace increase forever. We are informing you that the fledglings are tender, and the lambs are thin, and time for the spring has not come. And the matter is good before me and before my colleagues, and I have added thirty days to this year. Perhaps after they deposed
llm_translation: And take one parchment and write: To our brethren, the exiles in Babylon, and to our brethren in Media, and to all the rest of the exiles of Israel, may your peace increase forever. We inform you that the young pigeons are tender, and the figs are ripe, and the time of the spring has not yet come, and the matter is clear in my eyes and in the eyes of my colleagues, and I add to this thirty days. Perhaps it will pass after them.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: עַל שְׁלֹשָׁה דְּבָרִים מְעַבְּרִין אֶת הַשָּׁנָה – עַל הָאָבִיב, וְעַל פֵּירוֹת הָאִילָן, וְעַל הַתְּקוּפָה. עַל שְׁנַיִם מֵהֶן מְעַבְּרִין, וְעַל אֶחָד מֵהֶן אֵין מְעַבְּרִין.
human_translation: The Sages taught may intercalate the year for three matters: For the ripening of the grain, for the fruit of the trees, and for the equinox, two of intercalates but for one of them does not intercalate
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: On three things the year is determined - on the ripening of the grain, on the fruits of the tree, and on the equinox. On two of them we determine the year, and on one of them we do not determine the year.

hebrew_text: וּבִזְמַן שֶׁאָבִיב אֶחָד מֵהֶן – הַכֹּל שְׂמֵחִין. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: עַל הַתְּקוּפָה. אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: עַל הַתְּקוּפָה שְׂמֵחִין, אוֹ עַל הַתְּקוּפָה מְעַבְּרִין? תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: And when the ripening of the grain one of the concerns, everyone is happy. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: For the equinox. A dilemma was raised before For the equinox, happy, or for the equinox intercalate shall stand
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And at a time when one of them is in bloom - all are happy. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: concerning the equinox. They asked him: are we happy on the equinox, or do we pass over the equinox? The matter remains unresolved.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: עַל שְׁלֹשָׁה אֲרָצוֹת מְעַבְּרִין אֶת הַשָּׁנָה – יְהוּדָה, וְעֵבֶר הַיַּרְדֵּן, וְהַגָּלִיל. עַל שְׁתַּיִם מֵהֶן מְעַבְּרִין, וְעַל אַחַת מֵהֶן אֵין מְעַבְּרִין. וּבִזְמַן שֶׁיְּהוּדָה אַחַת מֵהֶן – הַכֹּל שְׂמֵחִין, שֶׁאֵין עוֹמֶר בָּא אֶלָּא מִיהוּדָה.
human_translation: The Sages taught may intercalate the year for three lands Judea, and Transjordan, and the Galilee. about two of them, intercalates but about one of them does not intercalate And when Judea is one of them, everyone is happy, because the omer comes only from Judea.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: Regarding three lands, they pass the year - Judea, Transjordan, and the Galilee. Regarding two of them, they pass the year, and regarding one of them, they do not pass the year. And when Judea is one of them - everyone is happy, for the Omer only comes from Judea.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אֵין מְעַבְּרִין אֶת הַשָּׁנִים אֶלָּא בִּיהוּדָה, וְאִם עִיבְּרוּהָ בַּגָּלִיל – מְעוּבֶּרֶת. הֵעִיד חֲנַנְיָה אִישׁ אוֹנוֹ: אִם עִיבְּרוּהָ בַּגָּלִיל – אֵינָהּ מְעוּבֶּרֶת. אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן פַּזִּי: מַאי טַעְמָא דַּחֲנַנְיָה אִישׁ אוֹנוֹ? אָמַר קְרָא: ״לְשִׁכְנוֹ תִדְרְשׁוּ וּבָאתָ שָּׁמָּה״, כׇּל דְּרִישׁוֹת שֶׁאַתָּה דּוֹרֵשׁ לֹא יִהְיוּ אֶלָּא בְּשִׁכְנוֹ שֶׁל מָקוֹם.
human_translation: The Sages taught may intercalate the years only in Judea. And if they intercalated it in the Galilee, intercalated. Ḥananya of Ono testified: if intercalated in the Galilee, it is not intercalated. Rabbi Yehuda, son of Rabbi Shimon ben Pazi, says: What is the reasoning of Ḥananya of Ono? The verse states: to His abode shall you seek, and there you shall come” Every pursuit that you shall pursue must be only in the abode of the Omnipresent,
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: One may only pass the years in Judea, and if they passed them in the Galilee – they are considered passed. Hananiah, the man of Ono, testified: If they passed them in the Galilee – they are not considered passed. Rabbi Yehudah, son of Rabbi Shimon ben Pazzi, said: What is the reason for the opinion of Hananiah, the man of Ono? He said a verse: "You shall seek out his dwelling place and come there," all interpretations that you seek should only be in the dwelling place of the location.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אֵין מְעַבְּרִין אֶת הַשָּׁנָה אֶלָּא בְּיוֹם, וְאִם עִיבְּרוּהָ בַּלַּיְלָה – אֵינָהּ מְעוּבֶּרֶת. וְאֵין מְקַדְּשִׁין אֶת הַחֹדֶשׁ אֶלָּא בַּיּוֹם, וְאִם קִידְּשׁוּהוּ בַּלַּיְלָה – אֵינוֹ מְקוּדָּשׁ. אָמַר רַב אַבָּא: מַאי קְרָא: ״תִּקְעוּ בַחֹדֶשׁ שׁוֹפָר בַּכֵּסֶה לְיוֹם חַגֵּנוּ״. אֵיזֶהוּ חַג שֶׁהַחֹדֶשׁ מִתְכַּסֶּה בּוֹ? הֱוֵי אוֹמֵר: זֶה רֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה. וּכְתִיב: ״כִּי חֹק לְיִשְׂרָאֵל הוּא מִשְׁפָּט לֵאלֹהֵי יַעֲקֹב״. מָה מִשְׁפָּט בַּיּוֹם – אַף קִידּוּשׁ הַחֹדֶשׁ בְּיוֹם.
human_translation: The Sages taught may intercalate the year only during the day; and if intercalated it at night, it is not intercalated. And may sanctify the month only during the day; and if sanctified it at night, it is not sanctified. Rav Abba says: What is the verse “Sound the shofar at the New Moon, at the concealed time for our Festival day” which Festival is the new moon concealed? You must say it is Rosh HaShana, And it is written “For it is a statute for Israel, a judgment of the God of Jacob” Just as judgment is during the day, so too is the sanctification of the month during the day.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: One may only declare the new year by day, and if they declared it at night - it is not declared. And one may only sanctify the new month by day, and if they sanctified it at night - it is not sanctified. Rav Abba said: What is the verse: "Blow the shofar at the new moon, at the covering for our feast day"? Which feast day is covered by the new moon? One should say: This is Rosh Hashanah. And it is written: "For it is a statute for Israel, a judgment for the God of Jacob." Just as judgment is during the day - so too, the sanctification of the new month is during the day.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אֵין מְעַבְּרִין אֶת הַשָּׁנָה
human_translation: The Sages taught does not intercalate the year
llm_translation: The Sages taught: "One does not transgress the year."

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁנֵי רְעָבוֹן.
human_translation: during years of famine.
llm_translation: In two famines.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: ״וְאִישׁ בָּא מִבַּעַל שָׁלִישָׁה וַיָּבֵא לְאִישׁ הָאֱלֹהִים לֶחֶם בִּכּוּרִים עֶשְׂרִים לֶחֶם שְׂעֹרִים וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi says “And there came a man from Ba’al Shalisha, and he brought to the man of God bread of the first fruits, twenty loaves of barley,
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi says, "And a man came from Baal-shalishah and brought to the man of God bread of firstfruits, twenty loaves of barley bread, etc."

hebrew_text: וְאֵין לְךָ קַלָּה בְּכׇל אֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל לְבַשֵּׁל פֵּירוֹתֶיהָ יוֹתֵר מִבַּעַל שָׁלִישָׁה, וְאַף עַל פִּי כֵן לֹא בִּכְּרָה אֶלָּא מִין אֶחָד. שֶׁמָּא תֹּאמַר: חִטִּים? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״שְׂעוֹרִים״. שֶׁמָּא תֹּאמַר: לִפְנֵי הָעוֹמֶר? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״תֵּן לָעָם וְיֹאכֵלוּ״. אַחַר הָעוֹמֶר הָיָה.
human_translation: You do not have in all of Eretz Yisrael fruit ripens more swiftly than Ba’al Shalisha, and even so, only one species ripened Lest you say wheat, the verse states “barley.” Lest you say before the omer the verse states: “Give to the people, that they may eat.” was after the omer
llm_translation: And you have no lightness in all the land of Israel to cook its fruits more than a third, and even so, not in a pot but of one kind. Perhaps you will say: wheat? The Talmud says: "barley." Perhaps you will say: before the omer? The Talmud says: "Give to the people and let them eat." After the omer it was.

hebrew_text: אֱמוֹר מֵעַתָּה: רְאוּיָה הָיְתָה אוֹתָהּ שָׁנָה שֶׁתִּתְעַבֵּר, וּמִפְּנֵי מָה לֹא עִיבְּרָהּ אֱלִישָׁע? שֶׁשְּׁנַת בַּצּוֹרֶת הָיְתָה, וְהָיוּ הַכֹּל רָצִין לְבֵית הַגֳּרָנוֹת.
human_translation: Based on this, say the year was fit to be intercalated, And for what did Elisha not intercalate it? Because it was a year of scarcity, and everyone was running to the granary.
llm_translation: Say from now: fitting was she year that conceived, and because why not conceive Elisha? that year of famine was, and were all desirous to house of granaries.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אֵין מְעַבְּרִין אֶת הַשָּׁנָה לִפְנֵי רֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה, וְאִם עִיבְּרוּהָ – אֵינָהּ מְעוּבֶּרֶת. אֲבָל מִפְּנֵי הַדְּחָק מְעַבְּרִין אוֹתָהּ אַחַר רֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה מִיָּד, וְאַף עַל פִּי כֵּן אֵין מְעַבְּרִין אֶלָּא אֲדָר.
human_translation: The Sages taught may not intercalate the year before Rosh HaShana. And if intercalated it it is not intercalated. But due to exigent may intercalate it immediately after Rosh HaShana. Even so, intercalate only Adar.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: One may not intercalate the year before Rosh Hashanah, and if they intercalated it - it is not intercalated. However, due to pressing circumstances, they may intercalate it immediately after Rosh Hashanah, yet even so, they only intercalate it in Adar.

hebrew_text: אִינִי? וְהָא שְׁלַחוּ לֵיהּ לְרָבָא: זוּג בָּא מֵרַקַּת, וּתְפָשׂוֹ נֶשֶׁר, וּבְיָדוֹ דְּבָרִים הַנַּעֲשִׂים בְּלוּז. וּמַאי נִיהוּ? תְּכֵלֶת. בִּזְכוּת הָרַחֲמִים וּבִזְכוּתָם יָצְאוּ בְּשָׁלוֹם.
human_translation: Is that so, But sent to Rava A pair came from Rakkath, but apprehended eagle, and in their possession items made in Luz. And what are those Sky-blue dye, In the merit of mercy and in their merit, they emerged in peace.
llm_translation: I am? And they sent to Rava: A pair came from the West, and they caught a hawk, and in his hand are things that are done in secret. And what are they? Techelet. Through the merit of the merciful and through their merit they went out in peace.

hebrew_text: וַעֲמוּסֵי יְרֵיכֵי נַחְשׁוֹן בִּקְּשׁוּ לִקְבּוֹעַ נְצִיב אֶחָד, וְלֹא הִנִּיחָן אֲדוֹמִי הַלָּז. אֲבָל בַּעֲלֵי אֲסוּפּוֹת נֶאֶסְפוּ וְקָבְעוּ לוֹ נְצִיב אֶחָד בְּיֶרַח שֶׁמֵּת בּוֹ אַהֲרֹן הַכֹּהֵן. חַשּׁוֹבֵי – מְחַשְּׁבִי, גַּלּוֹיֵי – לָא מְגַלּוּ.
human_translation: And the offspring of Nahshon, sought to establish a pillar, But that Edomite, did not allow them Nevertheless, the members of the assembly gathered, and they established a pillar, in the month in which Aaron the priest died, calculate not reveal
llm_translation: The Amusei Yerikhei Nachshon sought to establish one leader, but the Edomite did not allow them. However, the Ba'alei Asupot gathered and appointed one leader for them in the month in which Aharon the Kohen died. Hashovei - those who calculate, Galoyei - do not reveal.

hebrew_text: מַאי מַשְׁמַע דְּהַאי ״נְצִיב״ לִישָּׁנָא דְּיַרְחָא הוּא? דִּכְתִיב: ״וְלִשְׁלֹמֹה שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר נִצָּבִים עַל כׇּל יִשְׂרָאֵל וְכִלְכְּלוּ אֶת הַמֶּלֶךְ וְאֶת אֲנָשָׁיו חֹדֶשׁ בַּשָּׁנָה״. וְהָכְתִיב: ״וּנְצִיב אֶחָד [אֲשֶׁר] בָּאָרֶץ״? רַב יְהוּדָה וְרַב נַחְמָן, חַד אָמַר: אֶחָד מְמוּנֶּה עַל כּוּלָּם, וְחַד אָמַר: כְּנֶגֶד חֹדֶשׁ הָעִיבּוּר.
human_translation: From where may be inferred that this pillar [ netziv ] is a term for the month? As it is written: “And Solomon had twelve officers [ netzivim ] over all Israel, and they provided for the king and his household for a month in the year” But isn’t it written “And one officer that was in the land” Rav Yehuda and Rav Naḥman One says: One appointed over all of And one says: corresponded to the intercalated month.
llm_translation: What is the implication that this "נְצִיב" is the leader of the month? As it is written: "And for Solomon, twelve officers were over all Israel, who provided food for the king and his household each in its month." And it is written: "And one officer who was in the land"? Rav Yehudah and Rav Nachman, one said: One appointed over all of them, and one said: Corresponding to the month of Aviv.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אֵין מְעַבְּרִין אֶת הַשָּׁנָה לֹא מִשָּׁנָה לַחֲבֶרְתָּהּ, וְלֹא שָׁלֹשׁ שָׁנִים זוֹ אַחַר זוֹ. אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא שֶׁהָיָה חָבוּשׁ בְּבֵית הָאֲסוּרִים, וְעִיבֵּר שָׁלֹשׁ שָׁנִים זוֹ אַחַר זוֹ. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: מִשָּׁם רְאָיָה? בֵּית דִּין יָשְׁבוּ וְקָבְעוּ אַחַת אַחַת בִּזְמַנָּהּ.
human_translation: The Sages taught may not intercalate the year from one year to another, and not three years, one after the other. Rabbi Shimon says: an incident involving Rabbi Akiva when he was incarcerated in prison, and intercalated three years, one after the other. said to proof from there? court sat and established each one at its time.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: One does not intercalate the year neither from one leap year to another, nor three years consecutively. Rabbi Shimon said: There was an incident with Rabbi Akiva who was imprisoned, and he intercalated three years consecutively. They said to him: From there did you have a proof? The court sat and established one by one in its proper time.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אֵין מְעַבְּרִין אֶת הַשָּׁנָה לֹא בִּשְׁבִיעִית וְלֹא בְּמוֹצָאֵי שְׁבִיעִית. אֵימָתַי רְגִילִין לְעַבֵּר? עֶרֶב שְׁבִיעִית. שֶׁל בֵּית רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל הָיוּ מְעַבְּרִין בְּמוֹצָאֵי שְׁבִיעִית.
human_translation: The Sages taught may not intercalate the year in the Sabbatical nor in the year after the Sabbatical When accustomed to intercalate? eve of the Sabbatical of the house of Rabban Gamliel would intercalate in the year after the Sabbatical
llm_translation: The Sages taught: One does not transfer the year, neither in the seventh year nor at the conclusion of the seventh year. When do they customarily transfer? On the eve of the seventh year. The household of Rabban Gamliel would transfer at the conclusion of the seventh year.

hebrew_text: וּבִפְלוּגְתָּא דְּהָנֵי תַּנָּאֵי, דְּתַנְיָא: אֵין מְבִיאִין יָרָק מֵחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ, וְרַבּוֹתֵינוּ הִתִּירוּ. מַאי בֵּינַיְיהוּ? אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה: חוֹשְׁשִׁין לְגוּשֵׁיהֶן אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: And with regard to the dispute between these tanna’im , as it is taught may not import vegetables from outside Eretz Yisrael, and our Rabbis permitted What between Rabbi Yirmeya says: between concerned for their clods
llm_translation: In the dispute of those Tannaim, as it was taught: One may not bring vegetables from outside the land, and our Rabbis permitted. What is the difference between them? Rabbi Yirmiyah said: They are concerned about their quality.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אֵין מְעַבְּרִין אֶת הַשָּׁנָה מִפְּנֵי הַטּוּמְאָה.
human_translation: The Sages taught may not intercalate the year due to ritual impurity,
llm_translation: The sages taught: One does not intercalate the year because of impurity.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: מְעַבְּרִין. אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּחִזְקִיָּה מֶלֶךְ יְהוּדָה שֶׁעִיבֵּר אֶת הַשָּׁנָה מִפְּנֵי הַטּוּמְאָה, וּבִקֵּשׁ רַחֲמִים עַל עַצְמוֹ, דִּכְתִיב: ״כִּי מַרְבִּית הָעָם רַבַּת מֵאֶפְרַיִם וּמְנַשֶּׁה יִשָּׂשכָר וּזְבֻלוּן לֹא הִטֶּהָרוּ
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: may intercalate Rabbi Yehuda said: an incident involving Hezekiah, king of Judea, who intercalated the year due to ritual impurity And requested compassion for himself, as it is written: “For a multitude of the people, even many of Ephraim and Manasseh, Issachar and Zebulun, had not cleansed themselves,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehudah says: they pass over. Rabbi Yehudah said: There was an incident with King Hezekiah of Judah who passed over the year due to impurity, and he sought mercy for himself, as it is written: "For a multitude of the people, even many of Ephraim and Manasseh, Issachar, and Zebulun, had not cleansed themselves."

hebrew_text: כִּי אָכְלוּ אֶת הַפֶּסַח בְּלֹא כַכָּתוּב כִּי הִתְפַּלֵּל חִזְקִיָּהוּ עֲלֵיהֶם לֵאמֹר ה׳ הַטּוֹב יְכַפֵּר בְּעַד״.
human_translation: yet they ate the Paschal lamb not as is written. For Hezekiah had prayed for them, saying: May the good Lord pardon
llm_translation: When they ate the Pesach without as it is written, for Hezekiah prayed for them, saying, "The Lord, the good, may atone for them."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: אִם מִפְּנֵי הַטּוּמְאָה עִיבְּרוּהָ, מְעוּבֶּרֶת. אֶלָּא מִפְּנֵי מָה בִּיקֵּשׁ רַחֲמִים עַל עַצְמוֹ? שֶׁאֵין מְעַבְּרִין אֶלָּא אֲדָר, וְהוּא עִיבֵּר נִיסָן בְּנִיסָן. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהִשִּׂיא אֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל לַעֲשׂוֹת פֶּסַח שֵׁנִי.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: If intercalated due to ritual impurity, intercalated. But for what did request compassion for himself? Because intercalate only Adar, and he intercalated Nisan during Nisan Rabbi Shimon ben Yehuda says in the name of Rabbi Shimon: because encouraged the Jewish people to perform the second Pesaḥ .
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: If they made it leavened because of impurity, it is considered spoiled. Rather, for what reason did He seek mercy upon Himself? For only the majestic ones are passed over, and He passed over Nissan in Nissan. Rabbi Shimon ben Yehuda says in the name of Rabbi Shimon: Because He caused Israel to observe a second Passover.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: מְעַבְּרִין. אַלְמָא, אִית לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה: טוּמְאָה דְּחוּיָה הִיא בְּצִיבּוּר.
human_translation: The Master said Rabbi Yehuda says: intercalate Apparently, Rabbi Yehuda holds ritual impurity is overridden the public.
llm_translation: Master said: Rabbi Yehuda says: they pass over. This implies that Rabbi Yehuda holds: impurity that is pushed aside is considered impure in a public domain.

hebrew_text: וְהָא תַּנְיָא: צִיץ, בֵּין שֶׁיֶּשְׁנוֹ עַל מִצְחוֹ וּבֵין שֶׁאֵינוֹ עַל מִצְחוֹ – מְרַצֶּה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: עוֹדוֹ עַל מִצְחוֹ – מְרַצֶּה, אֵין עוֹדוֹ עַל מִצְחוֹ – אֵינוֹ מְרַצֶּה.
human_translation: But isn’t it taught The frontplate effects acceptance whether it is on the forehead of or whether it is not on the forehead of the statement of Rabbi Shimon. Rabbi Yehuda says: As long as it is on his forehead it effects acceptance; it is no longer on his forehead it does not effect acceptance.
llm_translation: The Gemara teaches: A forehead-plate, whether it is placed on the forehead or not on the forehead – it is acceptable, these are the words of Rabbi Shimon. Rabbi Yehuda says: If it is still on the forehead – it is acceptable, if it is no longer on the forehead – it is not acceptable.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל בְּיוֹם הַכִּיפּוּרִים יוֹכִיחַ, שֶׁאֵינוֹ עַל מִצְחוֹ וּמְרַצֶּה. אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: הַנַּח לְיוֹם הַכִּיפּוּרִים, שֶׁטּוּמְאָה הוּתְּרָה בְּצִיבּוּר.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon said to High Priest on Yom Kippur prove as not on the forehead of and effects acceptance. Rabbi Yehuda said to him: Leave on Yom Kippur, as impurity permitted in the public.
llm_translation: He said to him Rabbi Shimon: The High Priest on Yom Kippur should rebuke, that he not be cheerful and lighthearted. Rabbi Yehuda said to him: Let it be for Yom Kippur, that impurity is permitted in the community.

hebrew_text: וְלִיטַעְמָיךְ, תִּיקְשֵׁי לָךְ הִיא גּוּפַהּ: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר מְעַבְּרִין, וְאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּחִזְקִיָּה מֶלֶךְ יְהוּדָה שֶׁעִיבֵּר אֶת הַשָּׁנָה מִפְּנֵי הַטּוּמְאָה, וּבִיקֵּשׁ רַחֲמִים עַל עַצְמוֹ? אֶלָּא, חַסּוֹרֵי מְחַסְּרָא וְהָכִי קָתָנֵי: אֵין מְעַבְּרִין אֶת הַשָּׁנָה מִפְּנֵי הַטּוּמְאָה, וְאִם עִיבְּרוּהָ – מְעוּבֶּרֶת. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אֵינָהּ מְעוּבֶּרֶת. וְאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה וְכוּ׳.
human_translation: And according to your reasoning, itself should pose a difficulty for you. Rabbi Yehuda says: intercalate And Rabbi Yehuda said: an incident involving Hezekiah, king of Judea, who intercalated the year due to ritual impurity, and requested compassion for himself. Rather, is incomplete and this it is teaching: does not intercalate the year due to impurity, but if intercalated it, it is intercalated. Rabbi Yehuda says: it is not intercalated. And Rabbi Yehuda said
llm_translation: "And to taste it, it is difficult for you, it is its body: Rabbi Yehuda says they pass over, and Rabbi Yehuda said: There was an incident with King Hezekiah of Judah who passed over the year due to impurity, and he sought mercy for himself? Rather, lacking in deficiency, and thus it is taught: One does not pass over the year due to impurity, and if they did pass over it – it is passed over. Rabbi Yehuda says: It is not passed over. And Rabbi Yehuda said, etc."

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: אִם מִפְּנֵי הַטּוּמְאָה עִיבְּרוּהָ – מְעוּבֶּרֶת. הַיְינוּ תַּנָּא קַמָּא? אָמַר רָבָא: לְכַתְּחִלָּה אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ. תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: אֵין מְעַבְּרִין אֶת הַשָּׁנָה מִפְּנֵי הַטּוּמְאָה לְכַתְּחִילָּה. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: מְעַבְּרִין. אֶלָּא מִפְּנֵי מָה בִּקֵּשׁ רַחֲמִים עַל עַצְמוֹ? שֶׁאֵין מְעַבְּרִין אֶלָּא אֲדָר, וְהוּא עִיבֵּר נִיסָן בְּנִיסָן.
human_translation: If that is so, Rabbi Shimon says: If intercalated due to ritual impurity, intercalated. this is the first tanna , Rava said: between ab initio . This is also taught may not intercalate the year due to impurity ab initio . Rabbi Shimon says: may intercalate Rather, for what request compassion for himself? Because intercalate only Adar, but he intercalated Nisan during Nisan.
llm_translation: So it is, Rabbi Shimon says: If they postponed it because of impurity - it is postponed. Is this the first Tanna? Rava said: Initially there is a difference between them. Another teaching similarly: They do not postpone the year because of impurity initially. Rabbi Shimon says: They do postpone. But for what reason did he seek mercy for himself? Because they only postpone Adar, and he postponed Nissan in Nissan.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: שֶׁאֵין מְעַבְּרִין אֶלָּא אֲדָר, וְהוּא עִיבֵּר נִיסָן בְּנִיסָן. וְלֵית לֵיהּ לְחִזְקִיָּה ״הַחֹדֶשׁ הַזֶּה לָכֶם״ – זֶה נִיסָן, וְאֵין אַחֵר נִיסָן! טְעָה בְּדִשְׁמוּאֵל, דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: אֵין מְעַבְּרִין אֶת הַשָּׁנָה בְּיוֹם שְׁלֹשִׁים שֶׁל אֲדָר, הוֹאִיל וְרָאוּי לְקוֹבְעוֹ נִיסָן.
human_translation: The Master said because intercalate only Adar, and he intercalated Nisan during Nisan. But doesn’t Hezekiah accept “This month shall be for you this Nisan, and another cannot be Nisan. erred with regard to by Shmuel. As Shmuel says: may not intercalate the year on the thirtieth day of Adar, since fit to establish it Nisan.
llm_translation: Master said: "One only intercalates Adar, and he intercalated Nisan in Nisan." He does not have for Hezekiah, "This month shall be for you" - this is Nisan, and there is no other Nisan! He erred in the name of Samuel, for Samuel said: "One does not intercalate the year on the thirtieth day of Adar, since it is fitting to establish Nisan."

hebrew_text: וְאִיהוּ סָבַר: ״הוֹאִיל וְרָאוּי״ לָא אָמְרִינַן. תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: אֵין מְעַבְּרִין אֶת הַשָּׁנָה בְּיוֹם שְׁלֹשִׁים שֶׁל אֲדָר, הוֹאִיל וְרָאוּי לְקוֹבְעוֹ נִיסָן.
human_translation: And held: We do not say Since it is fit. This is also taught may not intercalate the year on the thirtieth day of Adar, since it is fit to establish it Nisan.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And he holds: "Since it is fitting," we do not say. It was taught similarly: One does not intercalate the year on the thirtieth day of Adar, since it is fitting to establish Nisan.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהִשִּׂיא אֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל לַעֲשׂוֹת פֶּסַח שֵׁנִי. הֵיכִי דָּמֵי? אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: כְּגוֹן שֶׁהָיוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל מֶחֱצָה טְמֵאִים, מֶחֱצָה טְהוֹרִים, וְנָשִׁים מַשְׁלִימוֹת לַטְּהוֹרִים וְעוֹדְפוֹת עֲלֵיהֶם.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Yehuda says in the name of Rabbi Shimon: because encouraged the Jewish people to perform the second Pesaḥ . What are the circumstances, Rav Ashi said: where half the Jewish people were impure half pure. And the women completed of the pure and exceeded
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Yehuda says in the name of Rabbi Shimon: Because he caused Israel to observe a second Passover. How so? Rav Ashi said: For example, when the Israelites were half impure and half pure, and the women contributed to the pure ones and made up the number for them.

hebrew_text: מֵעִיקָּרָא סְבַר: נָשִׁים בָּרִאשׁוֹן חוֹבָה, דְּהָווּ מִיעוּטָן טְמֵאִים, וּמִיעוּטָן מִידְּחוּ לְפֶסַח שֵׁנִי. וּלְבַסּוֹף סְבַר: נָשִׁים בָּרִאשׁוֹן רְשׁוּת, דְּהָווּ לְהוּ טְמֵאִים רוּבָּא, וְרוּבָּא לָא מִדְּחוּ לְפֶסַח שֵׁנִי.
human_translation: Initially, thought women an obligation in the first so the minority of are impure and minority deferred to the second Pesaḥ . In the end, thought women permitted in the first So the impure were the majority and the majority is not deferred to the second Pesaḥ .
llm_translation: From the outset he thought: Women in the first Passover offering are obligated, because they were in the minority in Egypt and the minority does not push off the second Passover. And in the end he thought: Women in the first Passover offering are optional, because they were mostly impure, and the majority does not push off the second Passover.

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא, אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: אֵין מְעַבְּרִין אֶת הַשָּׁנָה בְּיוֹם שְׁלֹשִׁים שֶׁל אֲדָר, הוֹאִיל וְרָאוּי לְקוֹבְעוֹ נִיסָן. עִיבְּרוּהָ, מַאי? אָמַר עוּלָּא: אֵין מְקַדְּשִׁין אֶת הַחֹדֶשׁ. קִידְּשׁוּ, מַאי? אָמַר רָבָא: בָּטֵל הָעִיבּוּר. רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר: מְעוּבָּר וּמְקוּדָּשׁ.
human_translation: the itself. Shmuel says: may not intercalate the year on the thirtieth day of Adar, since fit to establish Nisan. they intercalated what Ulla says: does not sanctify the month sanctified what Rava says: The intercalation is void, Rav Naḥman says: intercalated and sanctified,
llm_translation: The body, Samuel said: One does not intercalate the year on the thirtieth day of Adar, since it is fit to establish Nisan. If they intercalated it, what is the law? Ulla said: They do not sanctify the month. If they sanctified it, what is the law? Rava said: The intercalation is nullified. Rav Nahman said: It is both intercalated and sanctified.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא לְרַב נַחְמָן: מִכְּדֵי מִפּוּרַיָּא לְפִיסְחָא תְּלָתִין יוֹמִין הֲווֹ, וּמִפּוּרַיָּא דָּרְשִׁינַן בְּהִלְכוֹת הַפֶּסַח, דְּתַנְיָא: שׁוֹאֲלִין בְּהִלְכוֹת הַפֶּסַח קוֹדֶם לְפֶסַח שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: שְׁתֵּי שַׁבָּתוֹת. וְכִי מָטֵי רֵישׁ יַרְחָא מְרַחֲקִין לֵיהּ? אָתֵי לְזַלְזוֹלֵי בְּחָמֵץ!
human_translation: Rava said to Rav Naḥman: Now, from Purim to Passover is thirty days, and from Purim, we teach the halakhot of Passover. As it is taught ask with regard to the halakhot of Passover thirty days before Passover. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: two weeks And when the New Moon comes, distance come to treat the leavened bread lightly,
llm_translation: Rava said to Rav Nachman: From Purim until Pesach there are thirty days, and from Purim we engage in the laws of Pesach, as it was taught: One inquires about the laws of Pesach thirty days before Pesach. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Two Sabbaths. And when the head of the month of Nisan arrives, they distance him? He comes to mock with chametz!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִידָּע יָדְיעִי דְּשַׁתָּא מְעַבַּרְתָּא בְּחוּשְׁבָּנָא תַּלְיָא מִילְּתָא. אָמְרִי: חוּשְׁבָּנָא הוּא דְּלָא סְלֵיק לְהוּ לְרַבָּנַן עַד הַשְׁתָּא.
human_translation: said to know that the intercalated year a matter dependent upon the calculation, they say: It is the calculation that did not emerge for the Sages until now,
llm_translation: He said to him: "From the fact that you are passing over a matter in silence, it is evident that the matter is dependent on a calculation." They said: "It is the calculation that does not allow them to go to the Rabbis until now."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: אֵין מְעַבְּרִין אֶת הַשָּׁנָה אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן הָיְתָה תְּקוּפָה חֲסֵירָה רוּבֹּה שֶׁל חוֹדֶשׁ. וְכַמָּה רוּבֹּה שֶׁל חוֹדֶשׁ? שִׁשָּׁה עָשָׂר יוֹם; דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: intercalates the year only if the season was lacking most of the month And how much is: Most of the month? Sixteen days; the statement of Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: One may only intercalate the year if the equinox of the month of Adar is mostly deficient. And how deficient must the month of Adar be? Sixteen days; this is the statement of Rabbi Yehudah.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: אֶחָד וְעֶשְׂרִים יוֹם. וּשְׁנֵיהֶם מִקְרָא אֶחָד דָּרְשׁוּ: ״חַג הָאָסִיף תְּקוּפַת הַשָּׁנָה״. מָר סָבַר: כּוּלֵּיהּ חַג בָּעֵינַן בִּתְקוּפָה חֲדָשָׁה, וּמָר סָבַר: מִקְצָת חַג בָּעֵינַן בִּתְקוּפָה חֲדָשָׁה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: twenty-one days And both of them expounded the same verse the Festival of the Ingathering at the turn of the year” Sage, holds we require all of the Festival in the new season, And Sage, holds we require some of the Festival, in the new season,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: one and twenty days. And both of them expounded one verse: "the feast of ingathering at the turn of the year." Mar thought: we require the entire festival in a new season, and Mar thought: we require part of the festival in a new season.

hebrew_text: מַאי קָא סָבְרִי? אִי קָסָבְרִי יוֹם תְּקוּפָה גּוֹמֵר, בְּלָאו הָכִי נָמֵי, לָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר כּוּלֵּיהּ חַג אִיכָּא, וְלָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר מִקְצָת חַג אִיכָּא. אֶלָּא קָסָבְרִי יוֹם תְּקוּפָה מַתְחִיל.
human_translation: What do they hold? If they hold day of equinox concludes even is not this According to the one who says all of the Festival is not And according to the one who says some of the Festival is not Rather, they hold the day of the equinox begins
llm_translation: What do they hold? If they hold the day of the equinox is complete, even without this, it is also so, not according to the one who says there is a complete festival, and not according to the one who says there is a partial festival. Rather, they hold the day of the equinox begins.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: יוֹם תְּקוּפָה גּוֹמֵר, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: יוֹם תְּקוּפָה מַתְחִיל.
human_translation: raises an objection The day of the equinox concludes the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Yosei says: The day of the equinox begins
llm_translation: Challenger: Day equinox complete, words Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Yosei says: Day equinox begins.

hebrew_text: וְעוֹד, תַּנְיָא: אֵין מְעַבְּרִין אֶת הַשָּׁנָה אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן הָיְתָה תְּקוּפָה חֲסֵירָה רוּבּוֹ שֶׁל חוֹדֶשׁ. וְכַמָּה רוּבּוֹ שֶׁל חֹדֶשׁ? שִׁשָּׁה עָשָׂר יוֹם. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: שְׁתֵּי יָדוֹת בַּחוֹדֶשׁ. וְכַמָּה שְׁתֵּי יָדוֹת בַּחֹדֶשׁ? עֶשְׂרִים יוֹם.
human_translation: And furthermore, it is taught intercalates the year only if the season was lacking most of the month And how much Most of the month? Sixteen days. Rabbi Yehuda says: Two parts, of the month. And how much is: Two parts of the month? Twenty days,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And furthermore, it was taught: One may not intercalate the year unless the majority of the month of the deficient intercalary year has passed. And how much is the majority of the month? Sixteen days. Rabbi Yehuda says: Two hands in the month. And how much is two hands in the month? Twenty days.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: מְחַשְּׁבִין שִׁשָּׁה עָשָׂר לִפְנֵי הַפֶּסַח, מְעַבְּרִין; שִׁשָּׁה עָשָׂר לִפְנֵי הַחַג, אֵין מְעַבְּרִין. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: אַף שִׁשָּׁה עָשָׂר לִפְנֵי הַחַג מְעַבְּרִין. אֲחֵרִים אוֹמְרִים: מִיעוּטוֹ, וְכַמָּה מִיעוּטוֹ? אַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר יוֹם. קַשְׁיָא!
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: calculates before Passover, sixteen intercalates before the Festival sixteen does not intercalate Rabbi Shimon says: Even before the Festival sixteen intercalate Aḥerim says: a minority of and how much is a minority of Fourteen days. a difficulty,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: We calculate sixteen days before Passover, we may pass over; sixteen days before the Festival, we may not pass over. Rabbi Shimon says: Even sixteen days before the Festival we may pass over. Others say: It is a minority, and how much is a minority? Fourteen days. The question stands!

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: שְׁתֵּי יָדוֹת בַּחוֹדֶשׁ, עֶשְׂרִים יוֹם. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: מְחַשְּׁבִין שִׁשָּׁה עָשָׂר יוֹם לִפְנֵי הַפֶּסַח, מְעַבְּרִין. הַיְינוּ רַבִּי יְהוּדָה!
human_translation: The Master said Rabbi Yehuda says: two parts of the month twenty days. Rabbi Yosei says: calculates before Passover, sixteen intercalates That is Rabbi Yehuda,
llm_translation: The Master said: Rabbi Yehuda says: Two hands in the month, twenty days. Rabbi Yosei says: We calculate sixteen days before Passover, we pass over. That is Rabbi Yehuda!

hebrew_text: יוֹם תְּקוּפָה גּוֹמֵר, וְיוֹם תְּקוּפָה מַתְחִיל – אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: between them day of the equinox concludes or the day of the equinox begins
llm_translation: Day of equinox completes, and day of equinox begins - there is a difference between them.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: שִׁשָּׁה עָשָׂר לִפְנֵי הַחַג אֵין מְעַבְּרִין. אֶלָּא לְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי, שִׁשָּׁה עָשָׂר לִפְנֵי הַחַג הוּא דְּלָא, הָא שִׁיבְסַר וְתַמְנֵיסַר מְעַבְּרִין?
human_translation: The Master says: before the Festival sixteen does not intercalate Rather, according to Rabbi Yosei, before the Festival is sixteen is when not But seventeen or eighteen intercalate
llm_translation: Master said: Sixteen before the holiday, do not pass. Except for Rabbi Yosei, sixteen before the holiday, he is the one who does not pass, for the thirteenth and fourteenth do pass?

hebrew_text: וְהָאָמַר: שִׁשָּׁה עָשָׂר לִפְנֵי הַפֶּסַח – אִין, בְּצִיר – לָא!
human_translation: But doesn’t say: before Passover, sixteen yes, intercalates less not
llm_translation: And he said: "Sixteen before Pesach - yes, during the harvest - no!"

hebrew_text: לָא, אִידִי וְאִידִי אֵין מְעַבְּרִין, וְאַיְּידֵי דִּתְנָא רֵישָׁא ״שִׁשָּׁה עָשָׂר לִפְנֵי הַפֶּסַח״, תְּנָא נָמֵי ״שִׁשָּׁה עָשָׂר לִפְנֵי הַחַג״.
human_translation: No, this and that does not intercalate and since it taught the first clause: Sixteen before Passover, it also taught: Sixteen before the Festival
llm_translation: Not this, both not pass, and if that which taught in the beginning "sixteen before Passover," also taught "sixteen before the Festival."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: אַף שִׁשָּׁה עָשָׂר לִפְנֵי הַחַג מְעַבְּרִין. הַיְינוּ תַּנָּא קַמָּא?
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: Even before the Festival sixteen intercalate this is the first tanna ;
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: Even sixteen before the holiday they may pass. Is this the teaching of the first Tanna?

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ יוֹם תְּקוּפָה מַתְחִיל וְיוֹם תְּקוּפָה גּוֹמֵר. וְלָא מְסַיְּימִי.
human_translation: between them day of the equinox begins or the day of the equinox concludes but not defined.
llm_translation: There is between them a day of equinox, it begins and a day of equinox it ends. And they do not complete.

hebrew_text: אֲחֵרִים אוֹמְרִים: מִיעוּטוֹ, וְכַמָּה מִיעוּטוֹ? אַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר יוֹם. מַאי קָסָבְרִי? אִי קָסָבְרִי יוֹם תְּקוּפָה גּוֹמֵר, וְכוּלֵּיהּ חַג בָּעֵינַן – הָאִיכָּא! אָמַר רַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר רַב יִצְחָק: אֲחֵרִים בִּתְקוּפַת נִיסָן קָיְימִי, דִּכְתִיב: ״שָׁמוֹר אֶת חֹדֶשׁ הָאָבִיב״ – שְׁמוֹר אָבִיב שֶׁל תְּקוּפָה שֶׁיְּהֵא בְּחֹדֶשׁ נִיסָן.
human_translation: Aḥerim says: a minority of and how much is a minority of Fourteen days. What do hold? If they hold the day of the equinox concludes and we require all of the Festival this is Rav Shmuel bar Rav Yitzḥak says: Aḥerim are standing in, the season of Nisan. As it is written: “Observe the month of spring Preserve the equinox of spring, that it will be in the month of Nisan,
llm_translation: Others say: his limitation, and how much is his limitation? Fourteen days. What do they hold? If they hold the completion of the equinox day, and we require the entire festival - is there not! Rav Shmuel son of Rav Yitzchak said: Others hold in the equinox of Nisan, as it is written: "Observe the month of the Aviv" - observe the Aviv of the equinox that is in the month of Nisan.

hebrew_text: וְלִיעַבְּרֵיהּ לַאֲדָר? אָמַר רַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב: תַּנָּא מִלְּמַעְלָה לְמַטָּה קָחָשֵׁיב, וְהָכִי קָאָמַר: עַד מִיעוּטוֹ מְעַבְּרִין. וְכַמָּה מִיעוּטוֹ? אַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר יוֹם.
human_translation: But let them intercalate Adar Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov said: tanna calculated from the top, downward, and this is saying: Up to a minority of intercalate And how much is a minority? Fourteen days.
llm_translation: "And to pass it over to Adar? Rav Acha bar Yaakov said: It was taught: From above to below is considered significant, and thus he said: Until its decrease they pass it over. And how much is its decrease? Fourteen days."

hebrew_text: רָבִינָא אָמַר: לְעוֹלָם אֲחֵרִים בְּתִשְׁרִי קָיְימִי, וְקָסָבְרִי אֲחֵרִים כּוּלֵּיהּ חַג בָּעֵינַן, וְיוֹם טוֹב רִאשׁוֹן. יוֹם טוֹב רִאשׁוֹן? ״חַג הָאָסִיף״ כְּתִיב! חַג הַבָּא בִּזְמַן אֲסִיפָה.
human_translation: Ravina said: Actually, Aḥerim are standing in Tishrei, and Aḥerim hold we require all of the festival the Festival first the Festival first It is written: “The Festival of Ingathering” The Festival that comes at the time of ingathering,
llm_translation: Ravinah said: Always others in Tishrei are established, and they hold others all of the festival we require, and the first day of the festival. The first day of the festival? "The festival of ingathering" is written! The festival that comes at the time of ingathering.

hebrew_text: סְמִיכַת זְקֵנִים. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״וְסָמְכוּ זִקְנֵי״ – יָכוֹל זִקְנֵי הַשּׁוּק? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״עֵדָה״.
human_translation: laying of hands by the Sages The Sages taught “And the elders shall lay might elders the marketplace, the verse states: congregation,”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Semichat Zekeinim. Tanu Rabanan: "ve-samchu ziknei" - yakhol ziknei ha-shuk? Talmud lomar "edah." English translation: Placing of elders. The Rabbis taught: "And the elders shall lay their hands" - Could it be the elders of the market? The Torah teaches "congregation."

hebrew_text: אִי ״עֵדָה״ – יָכוֹל קְטַנֵּי עֵדָה? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״הָעֵדָה״ – מְיוּחָדִין שֶׁבָּעֵדָה. וְכַמָּה הֵן? ״וְסָמְכוּ״ – שְׁנַיִם, ״זִקְנֵי״ – שְׁנַיִם, וְאֵין בֵּית דִּין שָׁקוּל מוֹסִיפִין עֲלֵיהֶם עוֹד אֶחָד, הֲרֵי כָּאן חֲמִשָּׁה. דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: ״זִקְנֵי״ – שְׁנַיִם, וְאֵין בֵּית דִּין שָׁקוּל מוֹסִיפִין עֲלֵיהֶן עוֹד אֶחָד, הֲרֵי כָּאן שְׁלֹשָׁה.
human_translation: If “congregation,” might the minor ones of the congregation, the verse states: “The congregation,” the unique ones of the congregation, And how many they be? “Shall lay” two; “elders” two; and a court may not an even they add an additional one to them, there are five here; the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Shimon says: “Elders,” two, and a court may not an even they add an additional one to them, there are three here.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: If "edah" - can minors of the edah testify? The Torah teaches "ha'edah" - the distinguished individuals of the edah. And how many are they? "And they shall lean" - two, "the elders" - two, and the court does not add another one to them, here are five. These are the words of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Shimon says: "the elders" - two, and the court does not add another one to them, here are three.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, הָכְתִיב ״וְסָמְכוּ״? הָהוּא מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְגוּפֵיהּ. וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה? לְגוּפֵיהּ לָא צְרִיךְ, דְּאִם כֵּן דְּלָא אָתֵי ״וְסָמְכוּ״ לִדְרָשָׁה, לִיכְתּוֹב ״זִקְנֵי הָעֵדָה יְדֵיהֶם עַל רֹאשׁ הַפָּר״.
human_translation: But Rabbi Shimon, isn’t it written: “And shall lay”? That is necessary for itself, And Rabbi Yehuda is not necessary for itself, as if so, that “And shall lay” does not come to be interpreted, let it write: The elders of the congregation, their hands on the head of the bull,
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon, it is written "and they shall lean"? That one requires it for itself. And Rabbi Yehuda? For itself it is not necessary, for if so, since "and they shall lean" does not come for interpretation, it should have been written "the elders of the congregation shall lay their hands upon the head of the bull."

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, אִי כְּתִיב הָכִי, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: מַאי ״עַל״? בְּסָמוּךְ. וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה גָּמַר ״רֹאשׁ״ ״רֹאשׁ״ מֵעוֹלָה. וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן לָא גָּמַר ״רֹאשׁ״ ״רֹאשׁ״ מֵעוֹלָה.
human_translation: And Rabbi Shimon If it were written so, I would say: What “On [ al ] adjacent to And Rabbi Yehuda learns from “head” “head” a burnt offering, And Rabbi Shimon does not learn from “head” “head” a burnt-offering,
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon: If it were written thus, I would say: What is "al"? Adjacent. And Rabbi Yehuda concluded "rosh" "rosh" from above. But Rabbi Shimon did not conclude "rosh" "rosh" from above.

hebrew_text: תָּנָא: סְמִיכָה וּסְמִיכַת זְקֵנִים בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה. מַאי סְמִיכָה וּמַאי סְמִיכַת זְקֵנִים? אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מִיסְמַךְ סָבֵי.
human_translation: taught laying of hands and laying of hands by the Sages by three What laying of hands, and what laying of hands by the Sages? Rabbi Yoḥanan says: ordination of elders,
llm_translation: Mishna: Placing hands and the placing of elders require three. What is placing hands and what is the placing of elders? Rabbi Yochanan said: From leaning elders.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי לְרַב יוֹסֵף: מִיסְמַךְ סָבֵי בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה מְנָלַן? אִילֵּימָא מִדִּכְתִיב ״וַיִּסְמֹךְ אֶת יָדָיו עָלָיו״, אִי הָכִי תִּסְגֵּי בְּחַד! וְכִי תֵּימָא מֹשֶׁה בִּמְקוֹם שִׁבְעִים וְחַד קָאֵי, אִי הָכִי לִיבְעֵי שִׁבְעִים וְחַד! קַשְׁיָא.
human_translation: Abaye said to Rav Yosef: From where do we that the ordination of elders by three If we say from that it is written “And he laid his hands on him if so, it should be enough for one And if you would say: Moses stood in place of seventy-one, if so, should require seventy-one difficult;
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye to Rav Yosef: From where do we derive that leaning on the animal sacrifice requires three people? If you say it is because it is written, "And he leaned his hands upon it," if so, let it be done with one! And if you say Moses was standing in a place of seventy-one, if so, let seventy-one be required! This is a difficulty.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרָבָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: בִּידָא מַמָּשׁ סָמְכִין לֵיהּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: סָמְכִין לֵיהּ בִּשְׁמָא, קָרוּ לֵיהּ ״רַבִּי״, וְיָהֲבִי לֵיהּ רְשׁוּתָא לְמֵידַן דִּינֵי קְנָסוֹת.
human_translation: Rav Aḥa, son of Rava, said to Rav Ashi: ordain him literally with the hand? said to him: They ordain him by name he is called: Rabbi, and they give him permission to adjudicate laws of fines.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Ahah son of Rava said to Rav Ashi: Do we truly rely on his hand? He said to him: We rely on his name, they called him "Rabbi," and they gave him permission to teach us the laws of penalties.

hebrew_text: וְחַד לָא סָמֵיךְ? וְהָא אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: בְּרַם, זָכוּר אוֹתוֹ הָאִישׁ לַטּוֹב, וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בָּבָא שְׁמוֹ, שֶׁאִילְמָלֵא הוּא נִשְׁתַּכְחוּ דִּינֵי קְנָסוֹת מִיִּשְׂרָאֵל. נִשְׁתַּכְחוּ? נִגְרוֹסִינְהוּ! אֶלָּא
human_translation: And one not ordain But doesn’t Rav Yehuda say Rav says: Indeed [ beram ], that man will be remembered favorably, and Rabbi Yehuda ben Bava is his name, as had it not been for him the laws of fines would have been forgotten from the Jewish people. Would have been forgotten? Let them study them, Rather,
llm_translation: And is it not dependent on one condition? But didn't Rav Yehudah say in the name of Rav: However, that man was remembered for good, and Rabbi Yehudah ben Bava was his name, for if not for him, the laws of penalties would have been uprooted from Israel. Would have been uprooted? They would have been decreed! Rather

hebrew_text: בָּטְלוּ דִּינֵי קְנָסוֹת מִיִּשְׂרָאֵל, שֶׁפַּעַם אַחַת גָּזְרָה מַלְכוּת הָרְשָׁעָה שְׁמָד עַל יִשְׂרָאֵל – שֶׁכׇּל הַסּוֹמֵךְ יֵהָרֵג, וְכׇל הַנִּסְמָךְ יֵהָרֵג, וְעִיר שֶׁסּוֹמְכִין בָּהּ תֵּיחָרֵב, וּתְחוּמִין שֶׁסּוֹמְכִין בָּהֶן יֵעָקְרוּ.
human_translation: the laws of fines would have ceased from the Jewish people, because one time the wicked kingdom issued decrees of religious persecution against the Jewish people that anyone who ordains will be killed, and anyone who is ordained will be killed, and the city in which they ordain will be destroyed, and the boundaries in which they ordain will be uprooted.
llm_translation: The laws of penalties were nullified from the Jewish people, for one time the wicked kingdom decreed destruction upon Israel - that anyone who supports will be killed, and anyone who is supported will be killed, and a city that they support will be destroyed, and boundaries that they support will be uprooted.

hebrew_text: מָה עָשָׂה יְהוּדָה בֶּן בָּבָא? הָלַךְ וְיָשַׁב לוֹ בֵּין שְׁנֵי הָרִים גְּדוֹלִים, וּבֵין שְׁתֵּי עֲיָירוֹת גְּדוֹלוֹת, וּבֵין שְׁנֵי תְּחוּמֵי שַׁבָּת, בֵּין אוּשָׁא לִשְׁפַרְעָם, וְסָמַךְ שָׁם חֲמִשָּׁה זְקֵנִים. וְאֵלּוּ הֵן: רַבִּי מֵאִיר, וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי, וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן שַׁמּוּעַ. רַב אַוְיָא מוֹסִיף: אַף רַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה.
human_translation: What did Yehuda ben Bava do? He went and sat between two large mountains, between two large cities, and between two Shabbat boundaries: Between Usha and Shefaram, and there he ordained five elders. And they were: Rabbi Meir, and Rabbi Yehuda, and Rabbi Shimon, and Rabbi Yosei, and Rabbi Elazar ben Shammua. Rav Avya adds Rabbi Neḥemya also
llm_translation: What did Judah ben Baba do? He went and settled between two great mountains, and between two large cities, and between two Shabbat boundaries, between Usha and Shefar'am, and there he ordained five elders. And these are they: Rabbi Meir, Rabbi Yehuda, Rabbi Shimon, Rabbi Yosei, and Rabbi Elazar ben Shamua. Rav Avya adds: Also Rabbi Nechemiah.

hebrew_text: כֵּיוָן שֶׁהִכִּירוּ אוֹיְבֵיהֶם בָּהֶן, אָמַר לָהֶן: בָּנַיי, רוּצוּ! אָמְרוּ לוֹ: רַבִּי, מָה תְּהֵא עָלֶיךָ? אָמַר לָהֶן: הֲרֵינִי מוּטָל לִפְנֵיהֶם כְּאֶבֶן שֶׁאֵין לָהּ הוֹפְכִים. אָמְרוּ: לֹא זָזוּ מִשָּׁם עַד שֶׁנָּעֲצוּ בּוֹ שְׁלֹשׁ מֵאוֹת לוּנְכִיאוֹת שֶׁל בַּרְזֶל וַעֲשָׂאוּהוּ כִּכְבָרָה.
