human_translation: When their enemies discovered them, said to My sons, run They said to him: My teacher, what will be with you? said to them: I am cast before them like a stone that cannot be overturned; say did not move from there until they had inserted three hundred iron spears lunkhiyot into him, making him like a sieve
llm_translation: Once their enemies recognized them, he said to them: "My sons, run!" They said to him: "Rabbi, what will happen to you?" He said to them: "I am placed before them like a stone that has no turning." They said: "They did not move from there until they pierced him with three hundred iron spears and made him like a sieve."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בָּבָא אַחֲרִינֵי הֲווֹ בַּהֲדֵיהּ, וְהַאי דְּלָא חָשֵׁיב לְהוּ – מִשּׁוּם כְּבוֹדוֹ דְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בָּבָא. וְרַבִּי מֵאִיר, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בָּבָא סַמְכֵיהּ? וְהָא אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כׇּל הָאוֹמֵר רַבִּי מֵאִיר לֹא סְמָכוֹ רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא טוֹעֶה! סַמְכֵיהּ רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא וְלֹא קַיבְּלוּהּ, סְמָכֶיהָ רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בָּבָא וְקַיבְּלוּהּ.
human_translation: have been other with Rabbi Yehuda ben Bava, and this that they were not mentioned is due to the honor of Rabbi Yehuda ben Bava, And Rabbi Meir, Rabbi Yehuda ben Bava ordain him? But doesn’t Rabba bar bar Ḥana say Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Anyone who says that Rabbi Akiva did not ordain Rabbi Meir is nothing other than mistaken. Rabbi Akiva ordained but did not accept Rabbi Yehuda ben Bava ordained him and they accepted it.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehudah ben Bava had other colleagues with him, and this one who is not considered significant – it is out of respect for Rabbi Yehudah ben Bava. And Rabbi Meir, did Rabbi Yehudah ben Bava ordain him? But Rabba bar bar Ḥana said that Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Anyone who says that Rabbi Meir did not receive ordination from Rabbi Akiva is mistaken! Rabbi Akiva ordained him, and they did not accept it; Rabbi Yehudah ben Bava ordained him, and they accepted it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: אֵין סְמִיכָה בְּחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ. מַאי ״אֵין סְמִיכָה״? אִילֵּימָא דְּלָא דָּיְינִי דִּינֵי קְנָסוֹת כְּלָל בְּחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ, וְהָא תְּנַן: סַנְהֶדְרִין נוֹהֶגֶת בֵּין בָּאָרֶץ וּבֵין בְּחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ! אֶלָּא, דְּלָא סָמְכִינַן בְּחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi says: There is no ordination outside of Eretz What There is no ordination? If we say that they may not adjudicate laws of fines at all outside of Eretz Didn’t we learn Sanhedrin functions both in Eretz and outside of Eretz Rather, that we do not ordain outside of Eretz
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi: "There is no leaning in the public domain." What is meant by "there is no leaning"? If you say it is because we do not establish general laws of penalties in the public domain, but didn't we learn: The Sanhedrin functions both in the land and in the public domain! Rather, we do not lean in the public domain.

hebrew_text: פְּשִׁיטָא: סוֹמְכִין בְּחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ וְנִסְמָכִין בָּאָרֶץ, הָא אָמְרִינַן דְּלָא. אֶלָּא, סוֹמְכִין בָּאָרֶץ וְנִסְמָכִין בְּחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ – מַאי?
human_translation: obvious those ordaining outside of Eretz and those being ordained inside Eretz we say that not But those ordaining inside Eretz and those being ordained outside of Eretz what
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Pesheeta: somchin bechutzah la'aretz v'nis'machin ba'aretz, ha amrinan de'la. Ella, somchin ba'aretz v'nis'machin bechutzah la'aretz - mai? English translation: Conclusion: If one leans outside the land and supports himself in the land, do we not say that it is not valid? Rather, if one leans in the land and supports himself outside the land - what is the ruling?

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן הֲוָה מִצְטַעֵר עֲלֵיהּ דְּרַב שֶׁמֶן בַּר אַבָּא, דְּלָא הֲוָה גַּבַּיְיהוּ דְּלִיסְמְכֵיהּ. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן זֵירוּד וְחַד דְּעִימֵּיהּ, וּמַנּוּ? רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן בֶּן עַכְמַאי. וְאָמְרִי לַהּ: רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן בֶּן עַכְמַאי וְחַד דְּעִימֵּיהּ, וּמַנּוּ? רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן זֵירוּד. חַד דַּהֲוָה גַּבַּיְיהוּ – סַמְכוּהּו, וְחַד דְּלָא הֲוָה גַּבַּיְיהוּ – לָא סַמְכוּהּו.
human_translation: Come hear that Rabbi Yoḥanan was distressed concerning Rav Shemen bar Abba, as was not with so that could ordain him. Rabbi Shimon ben Zeirud and one who was with him, And who is he? Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Akhmai. And some say Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Akhmai and one who was with him; And who is he? Rabbi Shimon ben Zeirud. ordained one who was with them and they did not ordain one, who was not with them.
llm_translation: Come and hear: Rabbi Yohanan was distressed about the death of Rab Shemen bar Abba, for they did not ordain him. Rabbi Shimon ben Zeirud and one other were with him, and who was it? Rabbi Yonatan ben Akmai. And some say: Rabbi Yonatan ben Akmai and one other were with him, and who was it? Rabbi Shimon ben Zeirud. One who was ordained - support him, and one who was not ordained - do not support him.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי חֲנִינָא וְרַבִּי הוֹשַׁעְיָא הֲוָה קָא מִשְׁתְּקִיד רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן לְמִיסְמְכִינְהוּ. לָא הֲוָה מִסְתַּיְּיעָא מִילְּתָא, הֲוָה קָא מִצְטַעַר טוּבָא. אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: לָא נִצְטַעַר מָר, דַּאֲנַן מִדְּבֵית עֵלִי קָאָתֵינַן.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan persistently tried to ordain Rabbi Ḥanina and Rabbi Hoshaya, he was not successful the matter, he was very distressed They said to him: Do not be distressed, Master, as we come from, the house of Eli.
llm_translation: Rabbi Chanina and Rabbi Hoshaya were sitting, and Rabbi Yochanan was persistently seeking to join them. He was not able to find a resolution, and he was greatly distressed. They said to him: "Master, do not be distressed, for we are discussing matters of the House of Eli."

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָן אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן: מִנַּיִין שֶׁאֵין נִסְמָכִין לְבֵית עֵלִי? שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לֹא יִהְיֶה זָקֵן בְּבֵיתְךָ כׇּל הַיָּמִים״. מַאי זָקֵן? אִילֵּימָא זָקֵן מַמָּשׁ, וְהָכְתִיב: ״כׇּל מַרְבִּית בֵּיתְךָ יָמוּתוּ אֲנָשִׁים״! אֶלָּא סְמִיכָה.
human_translation: As Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥman says Rabbi Yonatan says: From where that there not ordained from the house of Eli? As it is stated “And there shall not be an elder in your house forever” What “elder” If we say an actual elder, but isn’t it written: “And all those raised in your house shall die young men” Rather, ordination
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachman said in the name of Rabbi Yonatan: From where do we derive that they do not support the house of Eli? As it is stated: "There shall not be an old man in your house all the days." What is meant by "old man"? If you say an actual old man, but it is written: "Men of your house shall die young!" Rather, it is through support.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי זֵירָא הֲוָה מִיטַּמַּר מִלְּמִיסְמְכֵיהּ, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: לְעוֹלָם הֱוֵה קָבֵל וְקַיָּים. כֵּיוָן דְּשַׁמְעַהּ לְהָא דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, אֵין אָדָם עוֹלֶה לִגְדוּלָּה אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן מוֹחֲלִין לוֹ עַל כׇּל עֲוֹנוֹתָיו, אַמְצִי נַפְשֵׁיהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira would hide so they would ordain him. that Rabbi Elazar said: Always be obscure and alive, When he heard that Rabbi Elazar said: A person does not rise to greatness unless all his sins are forgiven, he presented himself
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira was becoming weak from fasting, for Rabbi Elazar said: Always be accepting and enduring. Once she heard what Rabbi Elazar said, a person does not ascend to greatness unless they forgive him for all his sins, she found herself.

hebrew_text: כִּי סַמְכוּהּ לְרַבִּי זֵירָא, שָׁרוּ לֵיהּ הָכִי: ״לֹא כַּחַל וְלֹא שָׂרָק וְלֹא פִּירְכּוּס, וְיַעֲלַת חֵן״. כִּי סַמְכוּהּ לְרַבִּי אַמֵּי וּלְרַבִּי אַסִּי, שָׁרוּ לְהוּ הָכִי: ״כֹּל מִן דֵּין, כֹּל מִן דֵּין, סְמוּכוּ לַנָא. לָא תִּסְמְכוּ לַנָא לָא מִסַּרְמִיטִין וְלָא מִסַּרְמִיסִין״. וְאָמְרִי לַהּ: ״לָא מֵחֲמִיסִין וְלָא מִטּוּרְמִיסִין״.
human_translation: When they ordained Rabbi Zeira sang to him this no blue eye shadow and no rouge and no hair dye, and she radiates grace. when they ordained Rabbi Ami and Rabbi Asi, they sang to them this Anyone like these, anyone like these, ordain for us, do not ordain for us among the rags [ misarmitin ] or among the distorters [ misarmisin ]. And some say not among the robbers [ meḥamisin ] or among the tramplers [ miturmisin ].
llm_translation: Talmudic text: When they relied on Rabbi Zeira, they permitted him thus: "Not like a sandal, nor like a shoe, nor like a sock, but like a shoe of grace." When they relied on Rabbi Ammi and Rabbi Assi, they permitted them thus: "Everything from the judgment, everything from the judgment, rely on us. Do not rely on us neither from the Samaritans nor from the Samaritans." And some say to him: "Not from the Hamisim nor from the Turmisim." English translation:

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ, כִּי הֲוָה אָתֵי מִמְּתִיבְתָּא לְבֵי קֵיסָר, נָפְקִי מַטְרוֹנְיָתָא דְּבֵי קֵיסָר וּמְשַׁרְיָין לֵיהּ: ״רַבָּה דְּעַמֵּיהּ, מְדַבְּרָנָא דְּאוּמְּתֵיהּ, בּוּצִינָא דִּנְהוֹרָא, בְּרִיךְ מֵתְיָיךְ לִשְׁלָם״.
human_translation: when Rabbi Abbahu would come from the yeshiva to the house of the emperor, the ladies from the emperor’s house would go out and sing before him: O great one of his people, leader of his nation, illuminating candle, may your arrival be blessed in peace.
llm_translation: Rabbi Avahu, when he would come from the study hall to the house of Caesar, they would bring out a matronita of the house of Caesar and greet him: "Rabba d'amaihu, medabarna d'umteihu, butzina dinhora, berikh meiteikh lishlam."

hebrew_text: עֲרִיפַת עֶגְלָה בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״וְיָצְאוּ זְקֵנֶיךָ וְשֹׁפְטֶיךָ״. ״זְקֵנֶיךָ״ – שְׁנַיִם, ״שֹׁפְטֶיךָ״ – שְׁנַיִם, וְאֵין בֵּית דִּין שָׁקוּל מוֹסִיפִין עֲלֵיהֶן עוֹד אֶחָד, הֲרֵי כָּאן חֲמִשָּׁה. דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: ״זְקֵנֶיךָ״ – שְׁנַיִם, וְאֵין בֵּית דִּין שָׁקוּל מוֹסִיפִין עֲלֵיהֶם עוֹד אֶחָד, הֲרֵי כָּאן שְׁלֹשָׁה.
human_translation: the breaking of the heifer’s neck in three The Sages taught “And your elders and your judges shall go out “Your elders” two, “your judges” two, and a court may not an even they add an additional one to them, there are five here; the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Shimon says: “Your elders,” two, and a court may not an even they add an additional one to them, there are three here.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: The burning of the calf in three. The Rabbis taught: "And your elders and judges shall go out." "Your elders" - two, "your judges" - two, and a court does not add another one to them, here are five. These are the words of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Shimon says: "Your elders" - two, and a court does not add another one to them, here are three.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, הַאי ״שֹׁפְטֶיךָ״ מַאי עָבֵיד לֵיהּ? הַהוּא מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לִמְיוּחָדִין שֶׁבְּשׁוֹפְטֶיךָ. וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה? מִ״זִּקְנֵי״ ״זְקֵנֶיךָ״ נָפְקָא.
human_translation: But Rabbi Shimon, what does he do with this “Your judges”? He requires it to the unique ones among your judges, And Rabbi Yehuda derives from “Elders,” “Your elders,”
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon: "What does the term 'your judges' (shofetekha) signify?" - He requires it for the distinguished judges among your judges. And Rabbi Yehuda? It is derived from "your elders" (ziknei) - 'your elders' is distinguished.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: אִי מִ״זִּקְנֵי״ הֲוָה אָמֵינָא זִקְנֵי הַשּׁוּק, כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״זְקֵנֶיךָ״. וְאִי כְּתִיב ״זְקֵנֶיךָ״ – הֲוָה אָמֵינָא סַנְהֶדְרִי קְטַנָּה, כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״וְשֹׁפְטֶיךָ״ – מִמְּיוּחָדִין שֶׁבְּשׁוֹפְטֶיךָ. וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה גָּמַר ״זִקְנֵי״ ״זִקְנֵי״ מִ״וְסָמְכוּ זִקְנֵי הָעֵדָה אֶת יְדֵיהֶם״ – מָה לְהַלָּן מְיוּחָדִין שֶׁבָּעֵדָה, אַף כָּאן מְיוּחָדִין שֶׁבִּזְקֵנֶיךָ.
human_translation: And Rabbi Shimon had “Elders,” I would say elders the marketplace the Merciful One writes: “Your elders.” And if it was written: “Your elders,” I would say a lesser Sanhedrin. the Merciful One writes: “And your judges,” the unique ones among your judges. And Rabbi Yehuda He learns from “elders” “elders” “And the elders of the congregation shall lay their hands Just as there the unique ones of the congregation, so too here, the unique ones among your elders.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon: If it were written "זִקְנֵי" - I would say the elders of the market. The Merciful One wrote "זְקֵנֶיךָ." And if it were written "זְקֵנֶיךָ" - I would say a small Sanhedrin, the Merciful One wrote "וְשֹׁפְטֶיךָ" - those who are distinguished among your judges. And Rabbi Yehuda concluded "זִקְנֵי" "זִקְנֵי" from "וְסָמְכוּ זִקְנֵי הָעֵדָה אֶת יְדֵיהֶם" - just as there they are distinguished among the congregation, so too here they are distinguished among your elders.

hebrew_text: אִי יָלֵיף – לֵילַף כּוּלַּהּ מֵהָתָם! ״זְקֵנֶיךָ״ ״וְשֹׁפְטֶיךָ״ לְמָה לִי? אֶלָּא, וָיו ״וְשֹׁפְטֶיךָ״ לְמִנְיָינָא. וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן – וָיו לָא דָּרֵישׁ.
human_translation: If he learns he should learn all of it, from there, why do I “Your elders” “And your judges”? Rather, vav , “And your judges,” for the tally, And Rabbi Shimon He does not expound vav .
llm_translation: אִי יָלֵיף – לֵילַף כּוּלַּהּ מֵהָתָם! "זְקֵנֶיךָ" "וְשֹׁפְטֶיךָ" לְמָה לִי? אֶלָּא, וָיו "וְשֹׁפְטֶיךָ" לְמִנְיָינָא. וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן – וָיו לָא דָּרֵישׁ.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, ״וְיָצְאוּ״ – שְׁנַיִם, ״וּמָדְדוּ״ – שְׁנַיִם, לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה הֲרֵי תִּשְׁעָה, לְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן שִׁבְעָה? הָהוּא מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְכִדְתַנְיָא: ״וְיָצְאוּ״ – הֵן וְלֹא שְׁלוּחָן, ״וּמָדְדוּ״ – שֶׁאֲפִילּוּ נִמְצָא
human_translation: If that is so, “And they shall go out,” two, “And they shall measure,” two, to Rabbi Yehuda there nine to Rabbi Shimon, seven. He needs this for that which is taught “And they shall go out,” they and not their agents, “And they shall measure,” that even is found
llm_translation: Rather from now, "and they shall go out" - two, "and measure" - two, according to Rabbi Yehuda there are nine, according to Rabbi Shimon seven? That one wanted to teach him according to what is taught: "and they shall go out" - they are and not a table, "and measure" - that even if found.

hebrew_text: בַּעֲלִיל לָעִיר, צָרִיךְ לַעֲסוֹק בִּמְדִידָה.
human_translation: clearly to the city, must involve with measurement.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Ba'alil la'ir, tzarich la'asok bimididah." Translation: "Regarding the owner of the city, one must engage in measurement."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִיתִין דְּלָא כִּי הַאי תַּנָּא, דְּתַנְיָא: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב אוֹמֵר: ״וְיָצְאוּ זְקֵנֶיךָ וְשֹׁפְטֶיךָ״, ״זְקֵנֶיךָ״ – זוֹ סַנְהֶדְרִין, ״וְשֹׁפְטֶיךָ״ – זֶה מֶלֶךְ וְכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל. מֶלֶךְ – דִּכְתִיב: ״מֶלֶךְ בַּמִּשְׁפָּט יַעֲמִיד אָרֶץ״. כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל – דִּכְתִיב: ״וּבָאתָ אֶל הַכֹּהֲנִים הַלְוִיִּם וְאֶל הַשֹּׁפֵט״.
human_translation: The mishna is not in accordance with this tanna , as it is taught Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov says: “And your elders and your judges shall go out” “Your elders,” this Sanhedrin; “and your judges,” this king and High Priest. king as it is written: “The king by justice establishes the land” High Priest as it is written: “And you shall come to the priests the Levites, and to the judge
llm_translation: Mishnah that not like this Tanna, as it was taught: Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov says: "And your elders and judges shall go out," "your elders" - this refers to the Sanhedrin, "and your judges" - this refers to the king and the high priest. King - as it is written: "A king establishes the land with justice." High priest - as it is written: "And you shall come to the priests, the Levites, and to the judge."

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב בַּחֲדָא פְּלִיג אוֹ בְּתַרְתֵּי פְּלִיג? בְּמֶלֶךְ וְכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל פְּלִיג, אֲבָל בְּסַנְהֶדְרֵי – אִי כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אִי כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן? אוֹ דִילְמָא בְּסַנְהֶדְרֵי נָמֵי פְּלִיג, דְּאָמַר: כּוּלַּהּ סַנְהֶדְרִי בָּעֵינַן?
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before Does Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov disagree with regard to one or does he disagree with regard to two he disagree with regard to king and High Priest but with regard to the Sanhedrin either in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda or in accordance with Rabbi Shimon? Or perhaps he disagrees with regard to Sanhedrin, too, as he says we require all of the Sanhedrin
llm_translation: He asked them: Does Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov argue in one matter or in two matters? He argues in the case of a king and a high priest, but in the case of the Sanhedrin - is it like Rabbi Yehuda or like Rabbi Shimon? Or perhaps even in the case of the Sanhedrin he argues, as he said: Do we need the entire Sanhedrin?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: תָּא שְׁמַע, מְצָאָן אַבֵּית פַּגֵּי וְהִמְרָה עֲלֵיהֶן, יָכוֹל תְּהֵא הַמְרָאָתוֹ הַמְרָאָה? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְקַמְתָּ וְעָלִיתָ אֶל הַמָּקוֹם״, מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהַמָּקוֹם גּוֹרֵם.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: Come hear found in Beit Pagei and rebelled against them might his rebellion a rebellion the verse states: “And you shall arise and go up to the place teaches that the location determines
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: Come and hear, if one found lost animals of the household of Paggei and embittered them, can his embittering be effective? The verse teaches: "And you shall arise and go up to the place," indicating that the place causes it.

hebrew_text: דִּנְפוּק כַּמָּה? אִילֵּימָא מִקְצָתָן, דִּילְמָא הָנָךְ דְּאִיכָּא גַּוַּאי קָיְימִי כְּוָותֵיהּ? אֶלָּא פְּשִׁיטָא דִּנְפוּק כּוּלְּהוּ. לְמַאי? אִילֵימָא לִדְבַר הָרְשׁוּת, מִי מָצוּ נָפְקִי? וְהָכְתִיב: ״שׇׁרְרֵךְ אַגַּן הַסַּהַר אַל יֶחְסַר הַמָּזֶג״! אֶלָּא פְּשִׁיטָא לִדְבַר מִצְוָה.
human_translation: how many went out If we say some of them perhaps those who are inside hold in accordance with his Rather, obvious that they all went out. for what If we say for an optional matter, may they go out? But isn’t it written: “Your navel is like a round goblet wherein no blended wine is lacking” Rather, obvious for a matter a mitzva.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "How much should they pay? If you say some of them, perhaps the one who has a winepress standing in his field is different? Rather, it is obvious that they should all pay. For what? If you say for a matter of permission, did anyone go out? But it is written: 'Your vat will be full of wine, not lacking the mixture!' Rather, it is obvious for a matter of commandment."

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי דָּמֵי? לָאו לִמְדִידַת עֶגְלָה, וְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב הִיא, דְּאָמַר: כּוּלֵּי סַנְהֶדְרֵי בָּעֵינַן? אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: לָא, כְּגוֹן שֶׁיָּצְאוּ לְהוֹסִיף עַל הָעִיר וְעַל הָעֲזָרוֹת, כְּדִתְנַן: אֵין מוֹסִיפִין עַל הָעִיר וְעַל הָעֲזָרוֹת אֶלָּא בְּבֵית דִּין שֶׁל שִׁבְעִים וְאֶחָד.
human_translation: What are the circumstances? not to measure heifer, and it is Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov, that he says: We require all of the Sanhedrin Abaye said to him: No, where they went out to extend the city or the courtyards as we learned They may extend the city or the courtyards only in a court of seventy-one
llm_translation: How are they similar? It is not for the teaching of the calf, and Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov it is, as he said: Do we require the entire Sanhedrin? Abaye said to him: No, for example, when they went out to add to the city and to the courtyards, as we learned: One may only add to the city and to the courtyards through the court of seventy-one.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּוָותֵיהּ דְּרַב יוֹסֵף: מְצָאָן אַבֵּית פָּאגֵי וְהִמְרָה עֲלֵיהֶן, כְּגוֹן שֶׁיָּצְאוּ לִמְדִידַת עֶגְלָה וּלְהוֹסִיף עַל הָעִיר וְעַל הָעֲזָרוֹת, יָכוֹל שֶׁתְּהֵא הַמְרָאָתוֹ הַמְרָאָה? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְקַמְתָּ וְעָלִיתָ אֶל הַמָּקוֹם״, מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהַמָּקוֹם גּוֹרֵם.
human_translation: is taught in accordance with of Rav Yosef: he found them in Beit Pagei and rebelled against them, such as where they went out to measure heifer or to extend the city or the courtyards, might that his rebellion is a rebellion. the verse states: “And you shall arise and go up to the place,” teaches that the location determines
llm_translation: It was taught in accordance with the opinion of Rav Yosef: If they found Abaye's father's wine cellar and it turned sour, for example, if they went out to measure a calf for the city and the courtyards, can his souring be considered sour? The verse teaches: "And you shall arise and ascend to the place," indicating that the place causes it.

hebrew_text: נֶטַע רְבָעִי וּמַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי שֶׁאֵין דָּמָיו יְדוּעִין, בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אֵיזֶהוּ מַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי שֶׁאֵין דָּמָיו יְדוּעִין? פֵּירוֹת שֶׁהִרְקִיבוּ, וְיַיִן שֶׁהִקְרִיס, וּמָעוֹת שֶׁהֶחְלִידוּ. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי שֶׁאֵין דָּמָיו יְדוּעִין, פּוֹדִין אוֹתוֹ בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה לָקוֹחוֹת, אֲבָל לֹא בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה שֶׁאֵין לָקוֹחוֹת. אֲפִילּוּ גּוֹי אֶחָד מֵהֶן, אֲפִילּוּ אֶחָד מֵהֶם בְּעָלִים.
human_translation: a fourth-year sapling or second-tithe where their value is not known by three The Sages taught What is the second tithe whose value is not known fruit that has decomposed, and wine that has developed a film, and coins that have become rusted The Sages taught The second tithe whose value is not known may be redeemed by three purchasers, but not by three who are not purchasers. even one of them is a gentile, even one of them owner.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: A fourth-year plant and a second tithe whose identity is unknown, the law is with three years. The Rabbis taught: What is a second tithe whose identity is unknown? Fruits that have rotted, wine that has soured, and coins that have been lost. The Rabbis taught: A second tithe whose identity is unknown, one redeems it with three coins, but not with three coins where the identity is known. Even if one of them is a non-Jew, even if one of them is an owner.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה: שְׁלֹשָׁה וּמְטִילִין לְתוֹךְ כִּיס אֶחָד, מַהוּ? תָּא שְׁמַע: אִישׁ וּשְׁתֵּי נָשָׁיו פּוֹדִין מַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי שֶׁאֵין דָּמָיו יְדוּעִין. דִּילְמָא כְּגוֹן רַב פָּפָּא וּבַת אַבָּא סוּרָאָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya asks: three deposit into one purse, what is Come hear A man and his two wives may redeem second tithe where its value is unknown. Perhaps such as Rav Pappa and the daughter of Abba of Sura.
llm_translation: The question of Rabbi Yirmiyah: Three and they place into one pocket, what is the ruling? Come and hear: A man and his two wives redeem the second tithe when its value is unknown. Perhaps like Rav Papa and the daughter of Abba Sura.

hebrew_text: הַהֶקְדֵּשׁוֹת בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה. מַתְנִיתִין דְּלָא כִּי הַאי תַּנָּא, דְּתַנְיָא: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב אוֹמֵר, אֲפִילּוּ צִינּוֹרָא שֶׁל הֶקְדֵּשׁ צְרִיכָה עֲשָׂרָה בְּנֵי אָדָם לִפְדּוֹתָהּ.
human_translation: consecrated by three The mishna is not in accordance with this tanna , as it is taught Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov says: Even a small fork of consecrated property requires ten people to redeem it.
llm_translation: The consecrated items require three. The Mishnah teaches: Not like this Tanna, as it was taught: Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov says, even the pipe of the hekdesh requires ten people to redeem it.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב פָּפָּא לְאַבָּיֵי: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב, דְּאָמַר כִּשְׁמוּאֵל, דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: עֲשָׂרָה כֹּהֲנִים כְּתוּבִין בַּפָּרָשָׁה, אֶלָּא לְרַבָּנַן – שְׁלֹשָׁה מְנָא לְהוּ?
human_translation: Rav Pappa said to Abaye: Granted, Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov since he says in accordance with Shmuel. As Shmuel says: Ten priests are written in portion, But according to the Rabbis, from where do they three
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Papa to Abbaye: Granted for Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov, for he said like Shmuel, as Shmuel said: Ten priests are written in the portion, but for the Rabbis - how do they count three?

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא דִּכְתִיב בְּהוּ שְׁלֹשָׁה, קַרְקָעוֹת דִּכְתִיב בְּהוּ אַרְבָּעָה תִּיסְגֵּי בְּאַרְבָּעָה? וְכִי תֵּימָא: הָכִי נָמֵי, אַלְּמָה תְּנַן: הַקַּרְקָעוֹת תִּשְׁעָה וְכֹהֵן?
human_translation: And if you would say that is written with regard to them, three land, with regard to which is written four it should be enough in four And if you would say: Indeed why did we learn the land nine and priest?
llm_translation: And if you will say that it is written with three, the grounds, for it is written with four, will you say with four? And if you will say: So too, why do we learn: the grounds are nine and a priest?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מַאי, דְּמַשְׁלְמִי בְּהוּ עֲשָׂרָה? הֶקְדֵּשׁוֹת, דְּמַשְׁלְמִי בְּהוּ שִׁיתָּא, לִיבְעוֹ שִׁיתָּא! קַשְׁיָא.
human_translation: Rather, what That ten is completed with these, consecrated items that six is completed with them, should require six difficult.
llm_translation: Rather, what is the reason that one must pay ten? The holy things, for which one must pay six, let him pay six! It is difficult.

hebrew_text: הָעֲרָכִין כּוּ׳. מַאי עֲרָכִין הַמִּטַּלְטְלִין? אָמַר רַב גִּידֵּל אָמַר רַב: בְּאוֹמֵר ״עֵרֶךְ כְּלִי זֶה עָלַי״. דְּאָמַר רַב גִּידֵּל אָמַר רַב:
human_translation: the valuations What Valuations that are movable property? Rav Giddel says Rav says: where one says: The valuation of this utensil upon me As Rav Giddel says Rav says:
llm_translation: Talmudic text: The Arakhin 20a. What are the Arakhin that are suspended? Rav Giddel said in the name of Rav: By saying, "The value of this vessel is upon me." As Rav Giddel said in the name of Rav:

hebrew_text: הָאוֹמֵר: ״עֵרֶךְ כְּלִי זֶה עָלַי״ – נוֹתֵן דָּמָיו. מַאי טַעְמָא? אָדָם יוֹדֵעַ שֶׁאֵין עֵרֶךְ לִכְלִי, וְגָמַר וְאָמַר לְשׁוּם דָּמִים. מִשּׁוּם הָכִי נוֹתֵן דָּמָיו. הַאי ״עֲרָכִין הַמִּטַּלְטְלִין״? ״עֲרָכִין שֶׁל מִטַּלְטְלִין״ מִבַּעְיָא לֵיהּ! תְּנִי: עֲרָכִין שֶׁל מִטַּלְטְלִין.
human_translation: one who says: The valuation of this utensil is upon me give value of What is the reason A person knows that a utensil has no valuation, and decided and says to value, Due to that he gives its value. this Valuations that are movable property, should have Valuations of movable property. teach: Valuations of movable property.
llm_translation: One who says, "The value of this vessel is upon me" - he gives its value. What is the reason? A person knows that there is no value to a vessel, and he concluded and said for the sake of blood. Therefore, he gives its value. What is meant by "valuables of those who are being moved"? Valuables of those who are being moved are required! It was taught: Valuables of those who are being moved.

hebrew_text: רַב חִסְדָּא אָמַר אֲבִימִי: בְּמַתְפִּיס מִטַּלְטְלִין לַעֲרָכִין. הַאי ״עֲרָכִין הַמִּטַּלְטְלִין״? ״מִטַּלְטְלִין שֶׁל עֲרָכִין״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ! תְּנִי: מִטַּלְטְלִין שֶׁל עֲרָכִין.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda Avimi says one who associates movable property for the valuation. this Valuations that are movable property, should have Movable property of valuations. teach: Movable property of valuations.
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda said in the name of Avimi: With regard to "matpis mitaltelin to arakhin." What are these "arakhin that are mitaltelin"? It requires clarification! Teach: "Mitaltelin of arakhin."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ אָמַר: בְּאוֹמֵר ״עֶרְכִּי עָלַי״, בָּא כֹּהֵן לִגְבּוֹת מִמֶּנּוּ מִטַּלְטְלִין – בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה, קַרְקָעוֹת – בַּעֲשָׂרָה. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַחָא מִדִּיפְתִּי לְרָבִינָא: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְאַפּוֹקֵי מֵהֶקְדֵּשׁ בָּעֵינַן שְׁלֹשָׁה, אֶלָּא לְעַיּוֹלֵי לְהֶקְדֵּשׁ שְׁלֹשָׁה לְמָה לִי?
human_translation: Rabbi Abbahu says: one who says: My valuation is upon me priest came to collect movable property from him by three land by ten. Rav Aḥa of Difti said to Ravina: Granted, to take out from consecration we require three But to elevate to consecration, why do I three
llm_translation: Rabbi Avahu said: When one says, "My value is upon me," a Kohen comes to appraise movable property from him - with three, real estate - with ten. Rav Acha said to Ravina: If we are talking about redeeming from Hekdesh, it makes sense to require three, but for consecrating to Hekdesh, why do I need three?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: סְבָרָא הוּא, מָה לִי עַיּוֹלֵי, מָה לִי אַפּוֹקֵי? אַפּוֹקֵי מַאי טַעְמָא: דִילְמָא טָעֵי. עַיּוֹלֵי נָמֵי דִּילְמָא טָעֵי.
human_translation: said to him: is logical reasoning: What to me elevating what to me removing removing what is the reason perhaps he will err elevating also perhaps he will err
llm_translation: He said to him: It is a logical deduction, what do I need the young ones for, what do I need the old ones for? What do I need the old ones for? Perhaps they make a mistake. The young ones also, perhaps they make a mistake.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר כּוּ׳. אָמַר לֵיהּ רַב פָּפָּא לְאַבָּיֵי: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, הַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב ״כֹּהֵן״. אֶלָּא לְרַבָּנַן, ״כֹּהֵן״ לְמָה לְהוּ? קַשְׁיָא.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says Rav Pappa said to Abaye: Granted, according to Rabbi Yehuda, as it is written “Priest” But according to the Rabbis, why do they “priest”? difficult.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: "So it was said to him." Rav Papa said to Abbaye: "Granted for Rabbi Yehuda, that is what is written 'kohen.' But for the Rabbis, why 'kohen' for them? It is difficult."

hebrew_text: הַקַּרְקָעוֹת תִּשְׁעָה וְכֹהֵן. מְנָהָנֵי מִילֵּי? אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: עֲשָׂרָה כֹּהֲנִים כְּתוּבִין בַּפָּרָשָׁה, חַד לְגוּפֵיהּ, הָנָךְ הָוֵי מִיעוּט אַחַר מִיעוּט, וְאֵין מִיעוּט אַחַר מִיעוּט אֶלָּא לְרַבּוֹת, דַּאֲפִילּוּ תִּשְׁעָה יִשְׂרָאֵל וְאֶחָד כֹּהֵן.
human_translation: land nine and priest. From where is this matter Shmuel says: Priests are written in portion ten One for itself, These are a restrictive expression following a restrictive expression, And a restrictive expression following a restrictive expression only to amplify that even nine Israelites and one priest
llm_translation: The floors nine and a kohen. What are the mnemonic devices? Samuel said: Ten kohanim are written in the portion, one for itself, there should be a decrease after a decrease, and a decrease after a decrease is only to include, for even if there are nine Israelites and one kohen.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב נָתָן: אֵימָא, חֲמִשָּׁה כֹּהֲנִים וַחֲמִשָּׁה יִשְׂרְאֵלִים? קַשְׁיָא!
human_translation: Rav Huna, son of Rav Natan, objects to this say five priests and five Israelites, a difficulty.
llm_translation: Challenged him Rav Huna son of Rav Natan: Say, five Kohanim and five Yisraelim? Difficulty!

hebrew_text: וְאָדָם כְּיוֹצֵא בָּהֶן. אָדָם מִי קָדוֹשׁ? אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: בְּאוֹמֵר ״דָּמַי עָלַי״. דְּתַנְיָא: הָאוֹמֵר ״דָּמַי עָלַי״ – שָׁמִין אוֹתוֹ כְּעֶבֶד הַנִּמְכָּר בַּשּׁוּק. וְעֶבֶד אִתַּקַּשׁ לְקַרְקָעוֹת.
human_translation: a person in a similar manner. Can a person be consecrated? Rabbi Abbahu says: who says: My monetary value upon me As it is taught one who says: My monetary value upon me, appraises him as a slave who is sold in the market, And a slave is compared to land
llm_translation: And a person, like them. Who is a holy person? Rabbi Avahu said: One who says "my blood upon me." As it was taught: One who says "my blood upon me" - we listen to him like a slave who is being sold in the market. And a slave is attached to his clods.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רַבִּי אָבִין: שֵׂעָר הָעוֹמֵד לְיִגָּזֵז, בְּכַמָּה? כְּגָזוּז דָּמֵי, וּבִשְׁלֹשָׁה? אוֹ כִּמְחוּבָּר דָּמֵי, וּבַעֲשָׂרָה?
human_translation: Rabbi Avin raises a dilemma: hair which is ready to be shorn, by how many similar to shorn, and by three or as attached and by ten
llm_translation: Inquiries of Rabbi Avin: Hair that is standing to be cut, in how much? Like the cost of cutting, and in three? Or like the cost of a haircut, and in ten?

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: הַמַּקְדִּישׁ אֶת עַבְדּוֹ – אֵין מוֹעֲלִין בּוֹ. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: מוֹעֲלִין בִּשְׂעָרוֹ. וְקַיְימָא לַן דְּבִשְׂעָרוֹ הָעוֹמֵד לִיגָּזֵז פְּלִיגִי. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Come hear one who consecrates his slave, not misuse Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: from hair misuse And we maintain that with regard to hair that is ready to be shorn they disagree. Learn from
llm_translation: Come and hear: One who sanctifies his slave - we do not benefit from him. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: We benefit from his hair. And it is established for us that regarding his hair, the one who stands to shear it disagrees. Learn from this.

hebrew_text: נֵימָא: הָנֵי תַּנָּאֵי כְּהָנֵי תַּנָּאֵי. דִּתְנַן, רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: יֵשׁ דְּבָרִים שֶׁהֵן כַּקַּרְקַע וְאֵינָן כַּקַּרְקַע, וְאֵין חֲכָמִים מוֹדִים לוֹ. כֵּיצַד? עֶשֶׂר גְּפָנִים טְעוּנוֹת מָסַרְתִּי לָךְ, וְהַלָּה אוֹמֵר: אֵינָן אֶלָּא חָמֵשׁ – רַבִּי מֵאִיר מְחַיֵּיב, וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: כׇּל הַמְחוּבָּר לַקַּרְקַע הֲרֵי הוּא כַּקַּרְקַע.
human_translation: Let us say these tanna’im is like those tanna’im . As we learned Rabbi Meir says: There are entities that are like land and are not like land and the Rabbis do not concede to him. How I gave you ten vines laden and the other says: There were only five, Rabbi Meir deems liable And the Rabbis say: Any that is attached to the land is as the land
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Neima: hanai tanna'ei kehanei tanna'ei. Ditnan, Rabbi Meir omer: yesh devarim shehen k'karke'a ve'einan k'karke'a, ve'ein chachamim modim lo. Keitzad? Esar gefanim te'unot masarti lakh, vehalah omer: einan ela chamesh - Rabbi Meir mechayev, vachachamim omerim: kol hamchubar la'karke'a harei hu k'karke'a. English translation: Neima said: These tannaim are like the priests. As we learned, Rabbi Meir says: There are things that are like the ground and are not like the ground, and the sages do not agree with him. How so? I handed you ten grapevines laden with grapes, and the Halacha says: they are only five - Rabbi Meir obligates, and the sages say: anything attached to the ground is considered like the ground.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר חֲנִינָא: בַּעֲנָבִים הָעוֹמְדוֹת לִיבָּצֵר עָסְקִינַן. מָר סָבַר: כִּבְצוּרוֹת דָּמְיָין, וּמָר סָבַר: לָאו כִּבְצוּרוֹת דָּמְיָין. לָא, אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבִּי מֵאִיר. עַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמַר רַבִּי מֵאִיר הָתָם, (כֹּל) כַּמָּה דְּשָׁבְקַתְּ לְהוּ מִיכְחָשׁ כָּחֲשִׁי. אֲבָל שְׂעָרוֹ, (כֹּל) כַּמָּה דְּשָׁבְקַתְּ לְהוּ אַשְׁבּוֹחֵי מַשְׁבַּח.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yosei bar Ḥanina says: we are dealing with grapes that are ready to be picked. Sage, holds are considered as picked, and Sage, holds are not considered as picked. No, you even say Rabbi Meir Only there, Rabbi Meir says the more leaves them become lean But his hair, the more he leaves it improves,
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yosei bar Hanina said: In the grapes that are standing, we are dealing with the issue of blemishes. Master holds: They are like pressed grapes, and Master holds: They are not like pressed grapes. No, even if you say it is Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Meir did not say that there, (everything) as long as you leave them, they deteriorate. But his hair, (everything) as long as you leave them, they improve in praise.

hebrew_text: דִּינֵי נְפָשׁוֹת כּוּ׳. קָא פָּסֵיק וְתָנֵי, לָא שְׁנָא רוֹבֵעַ זָכָר וְלָא שְׁנָא רוֹבֵעַ נְקֵבָה. בִּשְׁלָמָא רוֹבֵעַ נְקֵבָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְהָרַגְתָּ אֶת הָאִשָּׁה וְאֶת הַבְּהֵמָה״. אֶלָּא רוֹבֵעַ זָכָר, מְנָא לַן?
human_translation: capital law categorically teaches there is no difference that copulated with a male, and there is no difference that copulated with a female. Granted, it copulated with a female, as it is written you shall kill the woman and the animal” But that copulated with a male, from where do we
llm_translation: Laws of capital cases. It was interrupted and taught: It is not different if it is a majority of males or if it is a majority of females. It is understandable if it is a majority of females, as it is written: "And you shall kill the woman and the animal." But if it is a majority of males, how do we count?

hebrew_text: דִּכְתִיב: ״כׇּל שֹׁכֵב עִם בְּהֵמָה מוֹת יוּמָת״. אִם אֵינוֹ עִנְיָן לְשׁוֹכֵב, תְּנֵיהוּ עִנְיָן לְנִשְׁכָּב. וְאַפְּקֵיהּ רַחֲמָנָא בִּלְשׁוֹן שׁוֹכֵב, לְאַקּוֹשֵׁי נִשְׁכָּב לְשׁוֹכֵב: מָה שׁוֹכֵב – הוּא וּבְהֶמְתּוֹ בְּעֶשְׂרִים וּשְׁלֹשָׁה, אַף נִשְׁכָּב – הוּא וּבְהֶמְתּוֹ בְּעֶשְׂרִים וּשְׁלֹשָׁה.
human_translation: As it is written: “Whoever lies with an animal shall be put to death” If is not matter of the one who lies apply it matter of the one who lie with And the Merciful One brought forth the term “lies,” to compare one who lie with to one who lies just as one who lies he and his animal are by twenty-three so too, one who lie with he and his animal by twenty-three
llm_translation: Talmudic text: It is written: "Anyone who lies with an animal shall surely be put to death." If it is not a matter for lying, both are a matter for lying down. And the Merciful One expressed it in the language of lying down, to equate those who lie down with those who are lain with: Just as one who lies down – he and his animal are at the age of twenty-three, so too one who is lain with – he and his animal are at the age of twenty-three.

hebrew_text: שׁוֹר הַנִּסְקָל בְּעֶשְׂרִים וּשְׁלֹשָׁה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הַשּׁוֹר יִסָּקֵל וְגַם בְּעָלָיו יוּמָת״. כְּמִיתַת הַבְּעָלִים כָּךְ מִיתַת הַשּׁוֹר. אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי לְרָבָא: מִמַּאי דְּהַאי ״וְגַם בְּעָלָיו יוּמָת״ לִכְמִיתַת בְּעָלִים כָּךְ מִיתַת הַשּׁוֹר הוּא דַּאֲתָא?
human_translation: an ox that is stoned by twenty-three as it is stated: “The ox shall be stoned and also its owner shall be put to death” as the death of the owner, so is the death of the ox. Abaye said to Rava: From where that this “And also its owner shall be put to death,” comes to that as the death of the owner, so is the death of the ox?
llm_translation: The ox that is stoned at twenty-three, as it is stated: "The ox shall be stoned, and also its owner shall die." Just as the death of the owners, so too is the death of the ox. Abaye said to Rava: From where do we derive that "and also its owner shall die" is like the death of the owners, so too is the death of the ox that it comes?

hebrew_text: אֵימָא לִקְטָלָא הוּא דַּאֲתָא! אִם כֵּן, לִיכְתּוֹב ״וְגַם בְּעָלָיו״, וְלִישְׁתּוֹק!
human_translation: say it comes to death If so, let it write and also its owner,” and let it be silent
llm_translation: He is a potential murderer who has come! If so, it should be written "and also his owner," and be silent!

hebrew_text: אִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא הָכִי, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא בִּסְקִילָה. בִּסְקִילָה סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ? קְטַל אִיהוּ – בְּסַיִיף, מָמוֹנוֹ – בִּסְקִילָה?
human_translation: Had the Merciful One written this I would say by stoning. enter your mind by stoning? he killed by the sword, his property by stoning?
llm_translation: If thus wrote the Merciful One, would I have believed in stoning. In stoning, has your mind come to consider? He killed him - with a sword, his money - with stoning?

hebrew_text: וְדִילְמָא הַאי דִּכְתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״יוּמָת״ לְאַקּוֹלֵי עִילָּוֵיהּ, לְאַפּוֹקֵי מִסַּיִיף לְחֶנֶק? הָנִיחָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר חֶנֶק חָמוּר, אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר חֶנֶק קִיל, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר?
human_translation: But perhaps this that the Merciful One wrote: “Shall be put to death,” to be lenient with him, to remove from sword to strangulation. This works out well according to the one who says strangulation severe But to the one who says strangulation a lighter what is there to say?
llm_translation: Perhaps this one who wrote "yumat" by the Merciful One, meant to say to hang him by his neck, to take him out from the sword to strangle? Let it stand according to the one who said strangulation is severe, but according to the one who said strangulation is lenient, what can be said?

hebrew_text: לָא סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ, דִּכְתִיב: ״אִם כֹּפֶר יוּשַׁת עָלָיו״. וְאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ בַּר קְטָלָא הוּא, וְהָכְתִיב: ״לֹא תִקְחוּ כֹפֶר לְנֶפֶשׁ רֹצֵחַ״!
human_translation: not enter your mind as it is written: “If a ransom be placed upon him, and if it enters your mind he is liable to death But isn’t it written: “You shall take no ransom for the life of a murderer
llm_translation: Your request is to translate the following Talmudic text into English word-for-word, maintaining the original style and format of Talmudic discourse. Here is the translation: Talmudic text: "La sakla da'atach, dikhtiv: 'Im kofer yushat alav.' Ve'ei sakla da'atach bar k'tala hu, vehichtiv: 'Lo tikchu kofer l'nafesh rotze'ach.'" English translation: "Not gone up your mind, as it is written: 'If ransom is laid upon him.' And if gone up your mind, it is a son of a murderer, and it is written: 'You shall not take ransom for the life of a murderer!'"

hebrew_text: אַדְּרַבָּה, מִשּׁוּם הִיא גּוּפַהּ: קְטַל אִיהוּ – לָא תִּיסְגֵּי לֵיהּ בְּמָמוֹנָא אֶלָּא בִּקְטָלָא. קְטַל שׁוֹרוֹ – לִיפְרוֹק נַפְשֵׁיהּ בְּמָמוֹנָא. אֶלָּא, אָמַר חִזְקִיָּה וְכֵן תָּנָא דְּבֵי חִזְקִיָּה: אָמַר קְרָא ״מוֹת יוּמַת הַמַּכֶּה רֹצֵחַ הוּא״ – עַל רְצִיחָתוֹ אַתָּה הוֹרְגוֹ, וְאִי אַתָּה הוֹרְגוֹ עַל רְצִיחַת שׁוֹרוֹ.
human_translation: On the contrary, due to this itself. killed it would not be enough for him money; only with execution. his ox killed he should redeem himself with money, Rather, Ḥizkiyya says, and so the school of Ḥizkiyya taught The verse states: “He that struck him shall be put to death; he is a murderer” You execute him for his murder, but you do not execute him for his ox’s murder.
llm_translation: Great! Here is the English translation of the Talmudic text you provided: "Ad'rabbah, mishum hiya gufah: ketal ihu - la tisgei lei b'mamona ela b'katala. Ketal shoro - lifrok nafshei b'mamona. Ela, amar Chizkiyah v'chen tanah d'vei Chizkiyah: amar kra 'mot yumat hamakeh rotzeach hu' - al retzichato atah horgo, v'ei atah horgo al retzichat shoro." I hope this translation is helpful to you in your study of the Talmud.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: שׁוֹר סִינַי בְּכַמָּה? מִי גָּמַר שָׁעָה מִדּוֹרוֹת, אוֹ לָא? תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּתָנֵי רָמֵי בַּר יְחֶזְקֵאל: ״אִם בְּהֵמָה אִם אִישׁ לֹא יִחְיֶה״ – מָה אִישׁ בְּעֶשְׂרִים וּשְׁלֹשָׁה, אַף בְּהֵמָה בְּעֶשְׂרִים וּשְׁלֹשָׁה.
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before By how many an ox Sinai Do derive time from generations, or not? Come hear that Rami bar Yeḥezkel taught: “Whether animal or man it shall not live.” just as a person by twenty-three so too an animal by twenty-three
llm_translation: He asked them: A Sinai ox at what age? Who completed an hour from its generations, or not? Come and hear, as it was taught by Ramei bar Yehezkel: "Whether an animal or a man, they shall not live" - just as a man at twenty-three, so too an animal at twenty-three.

hebrew_text: הָאֲרִי וְהַזְּאֵב כּוּ׳. אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: וְהוּא שֶׁהֵמִיתוּ, אֲבָל לֹא הֵמִיתוּ – לָא. אַלְמָא קָסָבַר: יֵשׁ לָהֶן תַּרְבּוּת וְיֵשׁ לָהֶן בְּעָלִים. רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁלֹּא הֵמִיתוּ. אַלְמָא קָסָבַר: אֵין לָהֶם תַּרְבּוּת וְאֵין לָהֶם בְּעָלִים.
human_translation: a lion or a wolf: Reish Lakish says: And that that has killed But they have not killed, no, Apparently, holds they have tamed and they have owners, Rabbi Yoḥanan says: even if they have not killed. Apparently, holds they do not have tamed, and they do not have owners.
llm_translation: The lion and the wolf, etc. Reish Lakish said: And if they killed, but did not kill - no. This implies that he holds: they have manners and they have owners. Rabbi Yochanan said: Even though they did not kill. This implies that he holds: they do not have manners and they do not have owners.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: כׇּל הַקּוֹדֵם לְהוֹרְגָן זָכָה. בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, לְמַאי זָכָה? זָכָה לְעוֹרָן. אֶלָּא לְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ, לְמַאי זָכָה? כֵּיוָן שֶׁהֵמִיתוּ, שַׁוִּינְהוּ רַבָּנַן כְּמַאן דִּגְמַר דִּינַיְיהוּ, וְאִיסּוּרֵי הֲנָאָה נִינְהוּ.
human_translation: We learned Rabbi Eliezer says: Anyone who kills them first merits. Granted, according to Rabbi Yoḥanan, what does he merit? merits, their hides; But according to Reish Lakish, what he merit? Since they have killed, the Sages made their equivalent to those whose verdicts have been issued and are items from which benefit is prohibited.
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: Rabbi Eliezer says, "Anyone who precedes to kill them is meritorious." Granted according to Rabbi Yochanan, what did he merit? He merited their skin. But according to Reish Lakish, what did he merit? Once they were killed, the Rabbis made them equivalent to one who has completed their judgment, and they are considered forbidden for any benefit.

hebrew_text: מַאי ״זָכָה״? זָכָה לַשָּׁמַיִם. תַּנְיָא כְּוָותֵיהּ דְּרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: אֶחָד שׁוֹר שֶׁהֵמִית וְאֶחָד בְּהֵמָה וְחַיָּה שֶׁהֵמִיתוּ – בְּעֶשְׂרִים וּשְׁלֹשָׁה. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: שׁוֹר שֶׁהֵמִית – בְּעֶשְׂרִים וּשְׁלֹשָׁה, וּשְׁאָר בְּהֵמָה וְחַיָּה שֶׁהֵמִיתוּ – כׇּל הַקּוֹדֵם לְהוֹרְגָן זָכָה בָּהֶן לַשָּׁמַיִם.
human_translation: What Merits, he merits according to Heaven, is taught in accordance with of Reish Lakish Both an ox that killed and domesticated animal or undomesticated animal that killed by twenty-three Rabbi Eliezer says: An ox that killed by twenty-three but other domesticated animals and undomesticated animals that killed, anyone who kills them first merits, with that according to Heaven.
llm_translation: What is "merit"? Merit for the heavens. It was taught in accordance with the opinion of Reish Lakish: One ox that was stoned and one other animal or wild beast that were stoned - with twenty-three. Rabbi Eliezer says: An ox that was stoned - with twenty-three, and the rest of the animals and wild beasts that were stoned - anyone who preceded in killing them, merited with them for the heavens.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר וְכוּ׳. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא הַיְינוּ תַּנָּא קַמָּא? אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ נָחָשׁ.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: Rabbi Akiva is first tanna ; between them a snake.
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva says, and so forth. Is Rabbi Akiva the same as the first Tanna? There is a difference between them - a snake.

hebrew_text: אֵין דָּנִין כּוּ׳. הַאי שֵׁבֶט דַּחֲטָא בְּמַאי? אִילֵימָא שֵׁבֶט שֶׁחִלֵּל אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת, אֵימַר דְּפַלֵּיג רַחֲמָנָא בֵּין יְחִידִים לִמְרוּבִּין לְעִנְיַן עֲבוֹדַת כּוֹכָבִים, בִּשְׁאָר מִצְוֹת מִי פְּלִיג? אֶלָּא בְּשֵׁבֶט שֶׁהוּדַּח.
human_translation: judges this tribe that sinned, in what If we say a tribe that desecrated Shabbat, say that the Merciful One distinguishes between individuals and multitudes with regard to idol worship, with regard to other mitzvot, does He distinguish Rather, a tribe that was subverted
llm_translation: One does not judge thus. With what did the tribe of Dan sin? If you say the tribe that desecrated the Sabbath, one might say that the Merciful One distinguishes between individuals and the majority regarding idol worship, but in other commandments, who does He distinguish? Rather, it is with the tribe that was pushed away.

hebrew_text: לְמֵימְרָא דִּבְדִינָא דְּרַבִּים דָּיְינִינַן לֵיהּ? כְּמַאן: לָא כְּרַבִּי יֹאשִׁיָּה וְלָא כְּרַבִּי יוֹנָתָן! דְּתַנְיָא: עַד כַּמָּה עוֹשִׂין עִיר הַנִּדַּחַת? מֵעֲשָׂרָה וְעַד מֵאָה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יֹאשִׁיָּה. רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן אוֹמֵר: מִמֵּאָה וְעַד רוּבּוֹ שֶׁל שֵׁבֶט.
human_translation: Is this to say that we judge with the halakha of a multitude, with whose not in accordance with Rabbi Yoshiya, and not in accordance with Rabbi Yonatan. As it is taught How many designated an idolatrous city? From ten until one hundred the statement of Rabbi Yoshiya. Rabbi Yonatan says: From one hundred until a majority of a tribe.
llm_translation: In the matter of the judgment of the court of the many, do we deem it sufficient for him? Like whom: not like Rabbi Yoshiyah and not like Rabbi Yonatan! As it was taught: How much do they make the city of the banished? From ten to a hundred, the words of Rabbi Yoshiyah. Rabbi Yonatan says: From a hundred to the majority of the tribe.

hebrew_text: וַאֲפִילּוּ רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן לָא קָאָמַר אֶלָּא רוּבּוֹ, אֲבָל כּוּלּוֹ לָא. אָמַר רַב מַתְנָה: הָכָא
human_translation: And even Rabbi Yonatan, said only a majority of but all of not Rav Mattana said: Here,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And even Rabbi Yonatan did not say 'but all of it,' rather 'most of it,' but not all of it." Rav Matna said: Here... English translation:

hebrew_text: בִּנְשִׂיא שֵׁבֶט שֶׁחָטָא עָסְקִינַן. מִי לָא אָמַר רַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה: ״כׇּל הַדָּבָר הַגָּדֹל יָבִיאוּ אֵלֶיךָ״ – דְּבָרָיו שֶׁל גָּדוֹל? הַאי נָמֵי גָּדוֹל הוּא.
human_translation: we are dealing with the Nasi of a tribe who has sinned. Doesn’t Rav Adda bar Ahava say: “They shall bring every great matter to you” Matters of a great one, this is also a great one,
llm_translation: In a case of a tribal leader who sinned, we are dealing with. Who did not say Rav Adda bar Ahava: "All great matters should be brought to you" - his words are of a great person? This one too is a great person.

hebrew_text: עוּלָּא אָמַר: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּבָאִין עַל עִסְקֵי נְחָלוֹת, וְכִתְחִילָּתָהּ שֶׁל אֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל. מָה תְּחִילָּתָהּ שִׁבְעִים וְאֶחָד, אַף כָּאן – שִׁבְעִים וְאֶחָד.
human_translation: Ulla said Rabbi Elazar where came about matters of inheritance, and as the beginning of Eretz Yisrael Just as the beginning, seventy-one so too here, seventy-one
llm_translation: Oula said: Rabbi Elazar said in Bava'in regarding matters of inheritances, and its beginning is the Land of Israel. Just as its beginning is seventy-one, so too here - seventy-one.

hebrew_text: אִי, מָה תְּחִילָּתָהּ קַלְפִּי, אוּרִים וְתוּמִּים, וְכׇל יִשְׂרָאֵל – אַף כָּאן קַלְפִּי, אוּרִים וְתוּמִּים, וְכׇל יִשְׂרָאֵל? אֶלָּא מְחַוַּורְתָּא כִּדְרַב מַתְנָה.
human_translation: If just as the beginning lots [ kalpei ], Urim VeTummim , and all of the Jewish people so too here, lots, Urim VeTummim , and all of the Jewish people. Rather, it is clear in accordance with of Rav Mattana,
llm_translation: If, what its beginning? Kalpi, Urim and Thummim, and all Israel - also here Kalpi, Urim and Thummim, and all Israel? Rather, Mechavvarta as Rav Matna.

hebrew_text: רָבִינָא אָמַר: לְעוֹלָם בְּשֵׁבֶט שֶׁהוּדַּח, וּדְקָא קַשְׁיָא לָךְ – בְּדִינָא דְּרַבִּים דָּיְינִינַן לֵיהּ? אִין, אַף עַל גַּב דְּקָטְלִינַן בְּיָחִיד, בֵּי דִינָא דְּרַבִּים דָּיְינִינַן לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Ravina said: actually a tribe that was subverted and which poses a difficulty for you, we judge with the halakha of a multitude, Yes, although we execute as individuals we judge them a court of the multitude,
llm_translation: Ravina said: Always with a staff that is pushed away, and it is difficult for you - in the judgment of the public do we judge it? No, even though we kill an individual, in the judgment of the public do we judge it.

hebrew_text: מִי לָא אָמַר רַבִּי חָמָא בְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי אָמַר רַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא: ״וְהוֹצֵאתָ אֶת הָאִישׁ הַהוּא אוֹ אֶת הָאִשָּׁה הַהִוא וְגוֹ׳״? אִישׁ וְאִשָּׁה אַתָּה מוֹצִיא לִשְׁעָרֶיךָ, וְאִי אַתָּה מוֹצִיא כָּל הָעִיר כּוּלָּהּ לִשְׁעָרֶיךָ. הָכָא נָמֵי: אִישׁ וְאִשָּׁה אַתָּה מוֹצִיא לִשְׁעָרֶיךָ, וְאִי אַתָּה מוֹצִיא כׇּל הַשֵּׁבֶט כּוּלּוֹ לִשְׁעָרֶיךָ.
human_translation: Doesn’t Rabbi Ḥama, son of Rabbi Yosei, say Rabbi Oshaya says: “And you shall take out that man or that woman You take out a man or a woman to your gates but you do not take out an entire city to your gates; Here also You take out a man or a woman to your gates, but you do not take out the entire tribe to your gates;
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Who did Rabbi Ḥama, son of Rabbi Yosei, say? Rabbi Osha'ya said: "And you shall bring out that man or that woman, etc." You bring out a man and a woman to your gates, but you do not bring out the entire city to your gates. Here too: You bring out a man and a woman to your gates, but you do not bring out the entire tribe to your gates.

hebrew_text: לֹא אֶת נְבִיא הַשֶּׁקֶר. מְנָהָנֵי מִילֵּי?
human_translation: a false prophet From where is this matter
llm_translation: Not the prophet the liar. What is the ruling regarding his words?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: אַתְיָא ״הֲזָדָה״ ״הֲזָדָה״ מִזָּקֵן מַמְרֵא, מָה לְהַלָּן בְּשִׁבְעִים וְאֶחָד – אַף כָּאן בְּשִׁבְעִים וְאֶחָד.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, says: derived presumptuousness from presumptuousness a rebellious elder. Just as there, against seventy-one so too here, by seventy-one
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Chanina, said: It is written, "hazadah, hazadah" from the elder of Mamre. Just as there, it is in seventy-one - so too here, it is in seventy-one.

hebrew_text: וְהָא ״הֲזָדָה״ כִּי כְּתִיבָא, בִּקְטָלָא הוּא דִּכְתִיבָא, וּקְטָלָא בְּעֶשְׂרִין וּתְלָתָא הוּא! אֶלָּא, אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: גָּמַר ״דָּבָר״ ״דָּבָר״ מֵהַמְרָאָתוֹ.
human_translation: But when presumptuousness is written it is written with regard to death and a death be by twenty-three Rather, Reish Lakish said: derived word from word, rebellion.
llm_translation: The text: "And this 'hazadah,' as it is written, it is in the killing that it is written, and the killing is twenty-three! Rather, Reish Lakish said: He completed 'davar' 'davar' from its appearance."

hebrew_text: וְלֶהְדַּר זָקֵן מַמְרֵא, וְלִגְמַר ״הֲזָדָה״ ״הֲזָדָה״ מִנְּבִיא הַשֶּׁקֶר? ״דָּבָר״ ״דָּבָר״ גְּמִיר, ״הֲזָדָה״ ״הֲזָדָה״ לָא גְּמִיר.
human_translation: And let a rebellious elder return, and let it be derived presumptuousness from presumptuousness a false prophet, derives word word, does not derive presumptuousness presumptuousness,
llm_translation: To honor an elder from Mamre, and to complete "hazadah," is "hazadah" from a false prophet? "Davar" "davar" is learned, "hazadah" "hazadah" is not learned.

hebrew_text: וְלֹא אֶת כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל. מְנָהָנֵי מִילֵּי? אָמַר רַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה: דְּאָמַר קְרָא ״כׇּל הַדָּבָר הַגָּדֹל יָבִיאוּ אֵלֶיךָ״, דְּבָרָיו שֶׁל גָּדוֹל.
human_translation: the High Priest From where is this matter Rav Adda bar Ahava says that the verse states: “They shall bring every great matter to you” matters to a great one,
llm_translation: "And not the high priest. What are the benefits? Rav Adda bar Ahava said: As the verse says, 'All matters that are great shall be brought to you,' referring to the words of the great one."

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: ״דָּבָר גָּדֹל״ – דָּבָר קָשֶׁה. אַתָּה אוֹמֵר דָּבָר קָשֶׁה, אוֹ אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא דְּבָרָיו שֶׁל גָּדוֹל? כְּשֶׁהוּא אוֹמֵר ״אֶת הַדָּבָר הַקָּשֶׁה יְבִיאוּן אֶל מֹשֶׁה״, הֲרֵי דָּבָר קָשֶׁה אָמוּר.
human_translation: raises an objection great matter a difficult matter Do you say a difficult matter, or is it only the matters to a great one? When it states “They brought the difficult matter to Moses” a difficult matter is stated
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: Meitivi: "davar gadol" - davar kashah. Atah omer davar kashah, o o einu ela devarav shel gadol? Kesh'hu omer "et hadavar hakashé yevi'un el Moshe," harei davar kashé amur.

hebrew_text: הוּא דְּאָמַר כִּי הַאי תַּנָּא, דְּתַנְיָא: ״דָּבָר גָּדֹל״ – דְּבָרָיו שֶׁל גָּדוֹל. אַתָּה אוֹמֵר דְּבָרָיו שֶׁל גָּדוֹל, אוֹ אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא דָּבָר הַקָּשֶׁה? כְּשֶׁהוּא אוֹמֵר ״הַדָּבָר הַקָּשֶׁה״, הֲרֵי דָּבָר קָשֶׁה אָמוּר. הָא מָה אֲנִי מְקַיֵּים ״דָּבָר גָּדֹל״? דְּבָרָיו שֶׁל גָּדוֹל.
human_translation: states in accordance with that tanna , as it is taught “great matter” matters to a great one. Do you say matters to a great one, or is it only a difficult matter? When it says the difficult matter a difficult matter is stated, how do I realize “great matter”? matters to a great one.
llm_translation: He who said: When this Tanna taught, as it was taught: "A great matter" - his words are those of a great one. Do you say his words are those of a great one, or are they only a difficult matter? When he says "a difficult matter," behold, a difficult matter is spoken. How do I fulfill "a great matter"? His words are those of a great one.

hebrew_text: וְהַאי תַּנָּא, תְּרֵי קְרָאֵי לְמָה לִי? חַד לְצַוָּאָה בְּעָלְמָא, וְחַד לַעֲשִׂיָּיה. וְאִידַּךְ? אִם כֵּן, לִכְתּוֹב אוֹ ״גָּדוֹל״ ״גָּדוֹל״, אוֹ ״קָשֶׁה״ ״קָשֶׁה״. מַאי ״גָּדוֹל״ וּמַאי ״קָשֶׁה״? שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ תַּרְתֵּי.
human_translation: And this tanna why do I two verses One for the command in general, and one to the execution And the other if so, let it write either “great” “great” or “difficult” “difficult” What “great” and what “difficult” Conclude two from it;
llm_translation: The Tanna said: "Why do I need two verses? One for the commandment itself, and one for the action. And the other? If so, write either 'great' 'great,' or 'difficult' 'difficult.' What is 'great' and what is 'difficult'? Understand from it two."

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: שׁוֹרוֹ שֶׁל כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל, בְּכַמָּה? לְמִיתַת בְּעָלִים דִּידֵיהּ מְדַמֵּינַן לֵיהּ, אוֹ דִילְמָא לְמִיתַת בְּעָלִים דְּעָלְמָא מְדַמֵּינַן לֵיהּ? אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: מִדְּקָא מִבַּעְיָא לֵיהּ שׁוֹרוֹ, מִכְלָל דְּמָמוֹנוֹ פְּשִׁיטָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar asked: the ox of a High Priest by how many we compare it to the death of its owner, or perhaps we compare it to the death of owners in general, Abaye said: Since he asked ox, by inference it was obvious to him that property
llm_translation: The question of Rabbi Elazar: The ox of the High Priest, for how much? Do we assess it based on the death of its owners themselves, or perhaps do we assess it based on the death of owners in general? Abaye said: Since he specifically asked about his ox, it is obvious that his monetary value is primary.

hebrew_text: פְּשִׁיטָא! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: הוֹאִיל וְכָתַב ״כׇּל הַדָּבָר הַגָּדֹל״, כׇּל דְּבָרָיו שֶׁל גָּדוֹל – קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: obvious? lest you say since it writes: “Every great matter,” all matters to a great one, teaches us
llm_translation: It is obvious! What might you say: since it is written "all the great matter," all of the words of the great one - he is informing us.

hebrew_text: אֵין מוֹצִיאִין וְכוּ׳. מְנָהָנֵי מִילֵּי? אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: דְּאָמַר קְרָא ״וְלִפְנֵי אֶלְעָזָר הַכֹּהֵן יַעֲמֹד״.
human_translation: bring out only From where is this matter Rabbi Abbahu says: as the verse states “And he shall stand before Elazar the priest,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Ein motziin ve'chul. Menahanei milei? Amar Rabbi Avahu: De'amar kra 'u'lifnei Elazar hakohen ya'amod'." English translation: "We do not bring out, etc. Are these words of importance? Rabbi Avahu said: As the verse states, 'And before Eleazar the priest he shall stand.'"

hebrew_text: הוּא – זֶה מֶלֶךְ, ״וְכׇל בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל אִתּוֹ״ – זֶה מְשׁוּחַ מִלְחָמָה, ״וְכׇל הָעֵדָה״ – זֶה סַנְהֶדְרֵי.
human_translation: “he,” this king, “And all of the children of Israel with him,” this anointed for war, “And all of the congregation”; this Sanhedrin.
llm_translation: He - this is the king, "and all the children of Israel with him" - this is the anointed for war, "and all the congregation" - this is the Sanhedrin.

hebrew_text: וְדִילְמָא לְסַנְהֶדְרֵי הוּא דְּקָאָמַר לְהוּ רַחֲמָנָא, דְּלִישַׁיְּילוּ בְּאוּרִים וְתוּמִּים?
human_translation: But perhaps that the Merciful One says that the Sanhedrin may ask of the Urim VeTummim ,
llm_translation: Perhaps it is to the Sanhedrin that he is saying, "Is it possible for the Merciful One to inquire through Urim and Thummim?"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, כִּי הָא דְּאָמַר רַב אַחָא בַּר בִּיזְנָא אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן חֲסִידָא: כִּנּוֹר הָיָה תָּלוּי לְמַעְלָה מִמִּטָּתוֹ שֶׁל דָּוִד. כֵּיוָן שֶׁהִגִּיעַ חֲצוֹת לַיְלָה, רוּחַ צְפוֹנִית מְנַשֶּׁבֶת בּוֹ וְהָיָה מְנַגֵּן מֵאֵלָיו. מִיָּד הָיָה דָּוִד עוֹמֵד וְעוֹסֵק בְּתוֹרָה עַד שֶׁעָלָה עַמּוּד הַשַּׁחַר. כֵּיוָן שֶׁעָלָה עַמּוּד הַשַּׁחַר, נִכְנְסוּ חַכְמֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל אֶצְלוֹ.
human_translation: Rather, like that which Rav Aḥa bar Bizna says Rabbi Shimon Ḥasida says: A lyre hung above David’s bed, and once midnight arrived, the northern wind would blow on it and play on its own. David would immediately rise and study Torah until the dawn arrived. Once dawn arrived, the Sages of Israel enter to him
llm_translation: Rather, for this that Rav Acha bar Bizna said in the name of Rabbi Shimon Chasida: A harp was suspended above David's bed. When midnight arrived, a northern wind would blow upon it, and it would play by itself. Immediately David would rise and engage in Torah study until the break of dawn. When the break of dawn arrived, the sages of Israel would enter to him.

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ לוֹ: אֲדוֹנֵינוּ הַמֶּלֶךְ, עַמְּךָ יִשְׂרָאֵל צְרִיכִין לְפַרְנָסָה. אָמַר לָהֶן: לְכוּ וְהִתְפַּרְנְסוּ זֶה מִזֶּה. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: אֵין הַקּוֹמֶץ מַשְׂבִּיעַ אֶת הָאֲרִי, וְאֵין הַבּוֹר מִתְמַלֵּא מֵחוּלְיָיתוֹ. אָמַר לָהֶם: לְכוּ פִּשְׁטוּ יְדֵיכֶם בִּגְדוּד.
human_translation: they said to him: Our master the king, your nation, Israel, requires sustenance. said to them: Go and sustain one another, said to him handful [ hakometz ] does not satisfy a lion, and a cistern not be filled from its mouth, told them: Go and take up arms with the troops
llm_translation: They said to him: Our master the king, your people Israel require sustenance. He said to them: Go and sustain one another. They said to him: The thorn does not satisfy the lion, and the pit does not fill from its own hole. He said to them: Go stretch out your hands in a group.

hebrew_text: מִיָּד יוֹעֲצִין בַּאֲחִיתוֹפֶל, וְנִמְלָכִין בְּסַנְהֶדְרִין, וְשׁוֹאֲלִין בְּאוּרִים וְתוּמִּים. אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: מַאי קְרָא?
human_translation: immediately sought advice from Ahithophel and they consulted the Sanhedrin and they asked the Urim VeTummim Rav Yosef says: What the verse
llm_translation: Immediately they consult with Ahithophel, and they are crowned in the Sanhedrin, and they inquire with Urim and Thummim. Rav Yosef said: What is the verse?

hebrew_text: ״וְאַחֲרֵי אֲחִיתֹפֶל בְּנָיָהוּ בֶּן יְהוֹיָדָע וְאֶבְיָתָר וְשַׂר צָבָא לַמֶּלֶךְ יוֹאָב״. ״אֲחִיתוֹפֶל״ – זֶה יוֹעֵץ, וְכֵן הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״וַעֲצַת אֲחִיתֹפֶל אֲשֶׁר יָעַץ וְגוֹ׳״. וּ״בְנָיָהוּ בֶּן יְהוֹיָדָע״ – זוֹ סַנְהֶדְרִין. ״אֶבְיָתָר״ – אֵלּוּ אוּרִים וְתוּמִּים.
human_translation: And after Ahithophel was Benaiah, son of Jehoiada; and Ebiathar; and the general of the king’s army, Yoav Ahithophel is advisor and so it says: “Now the advice of Ahithophel, which he counseled And Benaiah, son of Jehoiada the Sanhedrin, Ebiathar the Urim VeTummim ,
llm_translation: "And after Ahithophel, Benaiah son of Jehoiada and Abiathar and the general of the king Joab." "Ahithophel" - this is a counselor, as it says: "And the counsel of Ahithophel, which he counseled, etc." And "Benaiah son of Jehoiada" - this is the Sanhedrin. "Abiathar" - these are the Urim and Thummim.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״וּבְנָיָהוּ בֶּן יְהוֹיָדָע עַל הַכְּרֵתִי וְעַל הַפְּלֵתִי״. וְלָמָּה נִקְרָא שְׁמָן כְּרֵתִי וּפְלֵתִי? כְּרֵתִי – שֶׁכּוֹרְתִין דִּבְרֵיהֶן, וּפְלֵתִי – שֶׁמּוּפְלָאִין מַעֲשֵׂיהֶן. וְאַחַר כָּךְ ״שַׂר הַצָּבָא לַמֶּלֶךְ יוֹאָב״.
human_translation: And so it says “And Benaiah, son of Jehoiada, was over the Kereti and over the Peleti ” And why was called Kereti and Peleti ? Kereti they were decisive [ shekoretin ] in their pronouncements. Peleti their actions were wondrous [ shemufla’in ], and thereafter the general of the king’s army, Yoav,
llm_translation: "And so he says: 'And Benaiah the son of Jehoiada was over the Kerethites and over the Pelethites.' And why were they called Kerethites and Pelethites? Kerethites - because they cut off their words, and Pelethites - because their actions were wondrous. And afterwards, 'the commander of the army for King Joab.'"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אַדָּא, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק בַּר אֲבוּדִימִי: מַאי קְרָא? ״עוּרָה כְבוֹדִי עוּרָה הַנֵּבֶל וְכִנּוֹר אָעִירָה שָּׁחַר״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzḥak, son of Rav Adda, and some say Rabbi Yitzḥak bar Avudimi, said: What is the verse “Awake, my glory; awake, harp and lyre; I will awaken the dawn”
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yitzchak son of Rav Adda, and some say he said Rabbi Yitzchak son of Avudimi: What is the verse? "Awake, awake, put on thy strength, O Zion; put on thy beautiful garments, O Jerusalem, the holy city."

hebrew_text: וְאֵין מוֹסִיפִין עַל הָעִיר. מְנָהָנֵי מִילֵּי? אָמַר רַב שִׁימִי בַּר חִיָּיא, אָמַר קְרָא: ״כְּכׇל אֲשֶׁר אֲנִי מַרְאֶה אוֹתְךָ אֵת תַּבְנִית הַמִּשְׁכָּן וְכֵן תַּעֲשׂוּ״ – לְדוֹרוֹת הַבָּאִין.
human_translation: They may extend the city From where is this matter Rav Shimi bar Ḥiyya says: The verse states: “According to all that I show you, the pattern of the Tabernacle and so shall you do” for future generations;
llm_translation: And one does not add onto the city. What are the details? Rav Shimi bar Hiyya said, a verse says: "According to all that I show you, the pattern of the Tabernacle, and the pattern of all its furnishings, so shall you make it" - for future generations.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רָבָא: כׇּל הַכֵּלִים שֶׁעָשָׂה מֹשֶׁה, מְשִׁיחָתָן מְקַדַּשְׁתָּן. מִיכָּן וְאֵילָךְ, עֲבוֹדָתָן מְחַנַּכְתָּן. וְאַמַּאי? נֵימָא ״וְכֵן תַּעֲשׂוּ״ לְדוֹרוֹת הַבָּאִין!
human_translation: Rava raises an objection all of the utensils that Moses fashioned, their anointment consecrates them, From that forward, their service dedicates them, And why Let us say “And so shall you do,” for future generations
llm_translation: Rava raises an objection: All the vessels that Moses made, their anointing sanctifies them. From here and onwards, their service inaugurates them. And why? Let us say, "And so shall you do" for future generations!

hebrew_text: שָׁאנֵי הָתָם, דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״וַיִּמְשָׁחֵם וַיְקַדֵּשׁ אֹתָם״ – אוֹתָם בִּמְשִׁיחָה, וְלֹא לְדוֹרוֹת בִּמְשִׁיחָה.
human_translation: is different there, as the verse states: and he anointed them and he sanctified them” “them,” by anointment, but for generations not by anointment.
llm_translation: The matter is different there, as the verse states: "And he anointed them and sanctified them" - them with anointing, and not for generations with anointing.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא: אוֹתָם בִּמְשִׁיחָה, וּלְדוֹרוֹת – אִי בִּמְשִׁיחָה אִי בַּעֲבוֹדָה? אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: אָמַר קְרָא ״אֲשֶׁר יְשָׁרְתוּ בָם בַּקֹּדֶשׁ״, הַכָּתוּב תְּלָאָן בְּשֵׁירוּת.
human_translation: And say Those by anointment, but for generations either by anointment or by service. Rav Pappa says: The verse states with which they shall serve in the sanctuary” The verse renders it dependent upon service,
llm_translation: And why? Those who serve in anointing, and for generations - either in anointing or in service? Rav Papa said: Scripture says, "who serve in the sanctuary," the verse burdens them with singing.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא ״אֹתָם״ לְמָה לִי? אִי לָאו ״אֹתָם״, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: לְדוֹרוֹת בִּמְשִׁיחָה וּבַעֲבוֹדָה, דְּהָא כְּתִיב ״וְכֵן תַּעֲשׂוּ״. כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״אֹתָם״ – אוֹתָם בִּמְשִׁיחָה, וְלֹא לְדוֹרוֹת בִּמְשִׁיחָה.
human_translation: But why do I “them”? Had not “them,” I would say: For generations by anointment and by service as it is written: “And so shall you do.” Therefore, the Merciful One writes “them,” They by anointment, but for generations not by anointment.
llm_translation: Rather, "them" why do I need? If not "them," would I say: for generations in the Messiah and in the service, as it is written "and so you shall do." The Merciful One wrote "them" - them in the Messiah, and not for generations in the Messiah.

hebrew_text: וְאֵין עוֹשִׂין סַנְהֶדְרָאוֹת כּוּ׳. מְנָא לַן? כִּדְאַשְׁכְּחַן בְּמֹשֶׁה, דְּאוֹקִי סַנְהֶדְרָאוֹת, וּמֹשֶׁה בִּמְקוֹם שִׁבְעִים וְחַד קָאֵי.
human_translation: appoint Sanhedrin From where do we as we find with regard to Moses, who established courts and Moses stands in place of seventy-one
llm_translation: And they do not make Sanhedrins like. From where do we know? As it is found in Moses, that he established Sanhedrins, and Moses was in a place of seventy and one standing.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מִנַּיִין שֶׁמַּעֲמִידִין שׁוֹפְטִים לְיִשְׂרָאֵל? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״שֹׁפְטִים תִּתֵּן״. שֹׁטְרִים לְיִשְׂרָאֵל מִנַּיִין? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״שֹׁטְרִים תִּתֵּן״. שׁוֹפְטִים לְכׇל שֵׁבֶט וְשֵׁבֶט מִנַּיִין? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״שֹׁפְטִים לִשְׁבָטֶיךָ״. שׁוֹטְרִים לְכׇל שֵׁבֶט וְשֵׁבֶט מִנַּיִין? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״שֹׁטְרִים לִשְׁבָטֶיךָ״.
human_translation: The Sages taught From where that establish judges for Jewish people? The verse states: “You shall place judges From where officers for Jewish people? The verse states: “You shall place officers.” From where judges for each and every tribe? The verse states: judges for your tribes.” From where officers for each and every tribe? The verse states: officers for your tribes.”
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: From where do we derive that judges are appointed for Israel? The Torah states: "You shall appoint judges." From where do we derive that officers are appointed for Israel? The Torah states: "You shall appoint officers." From where do we derive that judges are appointed for each tribe? The Torah states: "Judges and officers you shall appoint in all your gates." From where do we derive that officers are appointed for each tribe? The Torah states: "Officers you shall appoint in all your tribes."

hebrew_text: שׁוֹפְטִים לְכׇל עִיר וָעִיר מִנַּיִין? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״שֹׁפְטִים לִשְׁעָרֶיךָ״. שׁוֹטְרִים לְכׇל עִיר וָעִיר מִנַּיִין? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״שֹׁטְרִים לִשְׁעָרֶיךָ״. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אֶחָד מְמוּנֶּה עַל כּוּלָּן, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״תִּתֶּן לְךָ״. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: ״לִשְׁבָטֶיךָ וְשָׁפְטוּ״ – מִצְוָה בַּשֵּׁבֶט לָדוּן אֶת שִׁבְטוֹ.
human_translation: From where judges for each and every city? The verse states: judges for your gates, From where officers for each and every city? The verse states: officers for your gates. Rabbi Yehuda says: one appointed over all of them, as it is stated: “You shall place over you,” Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: “For your tribes, and they shall judge.” a mitzva for a tribe to judge its tribe,
llm_translation: Judges for every city and city from where? The Talmud teaches: "Judges for your gates." Officers for every city and city from where? The Talmud teaches: "Officers for your gates." Rabbi Yehuda says: One appointed over all of them, as it is stated: "Appoint for yourself." Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: "For your tribes they shall judge" – it is a commandment for the tribe to judge its own tribe.

hebrew_text: וְאֵין עוֹשִׂין עִיר הַנִּדַּחַת. מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר יוֹסֵף אָמַר רַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא: דְּאָמַר קְרָא ״וְהוֹצֵאתָ אֶת הָאִישׁ הַהוּא אוֹ אֶת הָאִשָּׁה הָהִיא״. אִישׁ וְאִשָּׁה אַתָּה מוֹצִיא לִשְׁעָרֶיךָ, וְאִי אַתָּה מוֹצִיא כָּל הָעִיר כּוּלָּהּ לִשְׁעָרֶיךָ.
human_translation: a city may be designated an idolatrous city From where are these matters Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Yosef says Rabbi Oshaya says: As the verse states “And you shall take out that man or that woman You take out a man or a woman to your gates but you do not take out the entire city to your gates;
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And they do not make a city that has been designated for destruction. From where are these matters derived? Rabbi Hiyya bar Yosef said in the name of Rabbi Oshaya: As the verse states, "And you shall bring out that man or that woman." You bring out a man and a woman to your gates, but you do not bring out the entire city to your gates.

hebrew_text: אֵין עוֹשִׂין עִיר הַנִּדַּחַת בַּסְּפָר. מַאי טַעְמָא? ״מִקִּרְבֶּךָ״ אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא, וְלֹא מִן הַסְּפָר.
human_translation: may not designate an idolatrous city on the frontier. What is the reason The Merciful One states from your midst, but not from the frontier.
llm_translation: They do not make a city of refuge with a book. What is the reason? "From among your midst" the Merciful One said, and not from the book.

hebrew_text: וְלֹא שָׁלֹשׁ עָרֵי הַנִּדַּחַת, דִּכְתִיב: ״אַחַת״, אֲבָל עוֹשִׂין אַחַת אוֹ שְׁתַּיִם, דִּכְתִיב: ״עָרֶיךָ״. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״אַחַת״ – אַחַת וְלֹא שָׁלֹשׁ. אַתָּה אוֹמֵר: אַחַת וְלֹא שָׁלֹשׁ, אוֹ אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא אַחַת וְלֹא שְׁתַּיִם? כְּשֶׁהוּא אוֹמֵר: ״עָרֶיךָ״, הֲרֵי שְׁתַּיִם אָמוּר. הָא מָה אֲנִי מְקַיֵּים ״אַחַת״? אַחַת וְלֹא שָׁלֹשׁ.
human_translation: And three not idolatrous cities. as it is written: one But may designate one or two as it is written: “Your cities,” The Sages taught “One,” One, but not three. Do you say one, but not three, or rather, not one, but not two? When states: “Your cities,” two are stated. How do I realize “One”? One, but not three.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And not three cities of refuge, as it is written: "one," but they make one or two, as it is written: "your cities." The Rabbis taught: "one" - one and not three. You say: one and not three, or is it only one and not two? When it says: "your cities," behold, two are mentioned. How do I fulfill "one"? One and not three.

hebrew_text: זִימְנִין אָמַר רַב: בְּבֵית דִּין אֶחָד הוּא דְּאֵין עוֹשִׂין, הָא בִּשְׁנַיִם וּשְׁלֹשָׁה בָּתֵּי דִינִין – עוֹשִׂין. וְזִימְנִין אָמַר רַב: אֲפִילּוּ בִּשְׁנַיִם וּשְׁלֹשָׁה בָּתֵּי דִינִין לְעוֹלָם אֵין עוֹשִׂין. מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַב? מִשּׁוּם קׇרְחָה. אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא בְּמָקוֹם אֶחָד, אֲבָל בִּשְׁנַיִם וּשְׁלֹשָׁה מְקוֹמוֹת – עוֹשִׂין. רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: אֵין עוֹשִׂין מִשּׁוּם קׇרְחָה.
human_translation: At times Rav said: It is in one court that they may not designate but in two or three courts they may designate And at times Rav said: Even in two or three courts they may never designate What is the reasoning of Rav? due to desolation, Reish Lakish says: They taught only in one region, but in two or three regions they may designate Rabbi Yoḥanan says: They may not designate due to desolation.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Zimnin Amar Rav: Bebeit Din Echad Hu De'ein Osim, Ha Bishtayim Ushlosha Batei Dinin – Osim. VeZimnin Amar Rav: Afilu Bishtayim Ushlosha Batei Dinin Leolam Ein Osim. Mai Taama DeRav? Mishum Korcha. Amar Reish Lakish: Lo Shanu Ela BeMakom Echad, Aval Bishtayim Ushlosha Mekomot – Osim. Rabbi Yochanan Amar: Ein Osim Mishum Korcha. English translation: Zimnin said Rav: In one court they do not act, but in two or three courts – they act. And Zimnin said Rav: Even in two or three courts they never act. What is the reason of Rav? Because of discord. Reish Lakish said: They only taught this in one place, but in two or three places – they act. Rabbi Yochanan said: They do not act because of discord.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּוָותֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אֵין עוֹשִׂין שָׁלֹשׁ עֲיָירוֹת מְנוּדָּחוֹת בְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל, אֲבָל עוֹשִׂין אוֹתָם שְׁתַּיִם, כְּגוֹן אַחַת בִּיהוּדָה וְאַחַת בַּגָּלִיל. אֲבָל שְׁתַּיִם בִּיהוּדָה וּשְׁתַּיִם בַּגָּלִיל – אֵין עוֹשִׂין. וּסְמוּכָה לַסְּפָר – אֲפִילּוּ אַחַת אֵין עוֹשִׂין. מַאי טַעְמָא? שֶׁמָּא יִשְׁמְעוּ גּוֹיִם וְיַחְרִיבוּ אֶת אֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל.
human_translation: is taught in accordance with of Rabbi Yoḥanan: may not designate three cities idolatrous in Eretz Yisrael, but they may designate two, such as one in Judea and one in the Galilee. But they may not designate two in Judea or two in the Galilee. And near the frontier, they may not designate even one. What is the reason Perhaps the gentiles will hear and they will destroy Eretz Yisrael.
llm_translation: It was taught in accordance with the opinion of Rabbi Yochanan: Three defiled cities are not made in the land of Israel, but two are made, such as one in Judea and one in the Galilee. However, two in Judea and two in the Galilee - are not made. And near the border - not even one is made. What is the reason? Lest the gentiles hear and destroy the land of Israel.

hebrew_text: וְתִיפּוֹק לִי דְּ״מִקִּרְבֶּךָ״ אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא, וְלֹא מִן הַסְּפָר? רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן הִיא, דְּדָרֵישׁ טַעְמָא דִּקְרָא.
human_translation: But him derive that the Merciful One states: “From your midst,” But not from the frontier. is Rabbi Shimon, as he interprets the reason in the verse
llm_translation: "And it shall come out to me 'from within you,' said the Merciful One, and not from the book? It is Rabbi Shimon, who expounds the reason of the verse."

hebrew_text: סַנְהֶדְרִי גְּדוֹלָה הָיְתָה. מַאי טַעְמַיְיהוּ דְּרַבָּנַן דְּאָמְרִי וּמֹשֶׁה עַל גַּבֵּיהֶן? אָמַר קְרָא: ״וְהִתְיַצְּבוּ שָׁם
human_translation: the Great Sanhedrin was What is the reasoning of the Rabbis, who say Moses at the head of The verse states: and they shall stand there
llm_translation: The Great Sanhedrin existed. What are the reasons of the Rabbis who say, "And Moses was upon their heads"? The verse says, "And stand there."

hebrew_text: עִמָּךְ״, ״עִמָּךְ״ – וְאַתְּ בַּהֲדַיְיהוּ. וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה: ״עִמָּךְ״ מִשּׁוּם שְׁכִינָה.
human_translation: with you” “with you,” and you with them, And Rabbi Yehuda “with you” due to the Divine Presence
llm_translation: "With you," "with you" - and you are included. And Rabbi Yehuda: "With you" because of the Divine Presence.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן, אָמַר קְרָא: ״וְנָשְׂאוּ אִתְּךָ בְּמַשָּׂא הָעָם״, ״אִתְּךָ״ – וְאַתְּ בַּהֲדַיְיהוּ. וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה: ״אִתְּךָ״ – בְּדוֹמִין לָךְ.
human_translation: And the Rabbis The verse states: “And they shall bear the burden of the people with you” “With you,” and you with them. And Rabbi Yehuda “with you” similar to you,
llm_translation: The sages said: Scripture states, "And they shall bear with you in the burden of the people," "with you" – and you with them. And Rabbi Yehuda said: "with you" – similar to you.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן, מִ״וְהָקֵל מֵעָלֶיךָ וְנָשְׂאוּ אִתָּךְ״ נָפְקָא. וְיָלְפָא סַנְהֶדְרִי גְּדוֹלָה מִסַּנְהֶדְרִי קְטַנָּה.
human_translation: And the Rabbis derive it from “And they shall make it easier for you, and bear the burden with you” And the Great Sanhedrin is derived from the lesser Sanhedrin,
llm_translation: The sages, "And they shall lighten the burden with you" was derived. And a great Sanhedrin is greater than a small Sanhedrin.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״וַיִּשָּׁאֲרוּ שְׁנֵי אֲנָשִׁים בַּמַּחֲנֶה״. יֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים: בַּקַּלְפִּי נִשְׁתַּיְּירוּ.
human_translation: The Sages taught: “And there remained two men in the camp; Some say they, remained in the box.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: "And two men remained in the camp." Some say: They were left with the "kalpi."

hebrew_text: שֶׁבְּשָׁעָה שֶׁאָמַר לוֹ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לְמֹשֶׁה: ״אֶסְפָה לִּי שִׁבְעִים אִישׁ מִזִּקְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל״, אָמַר מֹשֶׁה: כֵּיצַד אֶעֱשֶׂה? אֶבְרוֹר שִׁשָּׁה מִכׇּל שֵׁבֶט וְשֵׁבֶט – נִמְצְאוּ שְׁנַיִם יְתֵירִים. אֶבְרוֹר חֲמִשָּׁה חֲמִשָּׁה מִכׇּל שֵׁבֶט וְשֵׁבֶט – נִמְצְאוּ עֲשָׂרָה חֲסֵרִים. אֶבְרוֹר שִׁשָּׁה מִשֵּׁבֶט זֶה וַחֲמִשָּׁה מִשֵּׁבֶט זֶה – הֲרֵינִי מֵטִיל קִנְאָה בֵּין הַשְּׁבָטִים.
human_translation: At the time that the Holy One, Blessed be He, said to Moses: “Gather for Me seventy men of the Elders of Israel” Moses said: How shall I do I select six from each and every tribe, there will be two extra. I select five from each and every tribe, there will be lacking ten. I select six from this tribe and five from that tribe, I will bring about envy between the tribes,
llm_translation: In the hour that the Holy One, blessed be He, said to Moses: "Gather for Me seventy men from the elders of Israel," Moses said: How shall I do this? I will select six from each tribe, and tribe - two will remain extra. I will select five, five from each tribe, and tribe - ten will be lacking. I will select six from this tribe, and five from that tribe - behold, I will sow jealousy among the tribes.

hebrew_text: מָה עָשָׂה? בֵּירַר שִׁשָּׁה שִׁשָּׁה, וְהֵבִיא שִׁבְעִים וּשְׁנַיִם פִּיתְקִין. עַל שִׁבְעִים כָּתַב ״זָקֵן״, וּשְׁנַיִם הִנִּיחַ חָלָק. בְּלָלָן וּנְתָנָן בְּקַלְפִּי. אָמַר לָהֶם: בּוֹאוּ וּטְלוּ פִּיתְקֵיכֶם! כׇּל מִי שֶׁעָלָה בְּיָדוֹ ״זָקֵן״, אָמַר: כְּבָר קִידֶּשְׁךָ שָׁמַיִם. מִי שֶׁעָלָה בְּיָדוֹ חָלָק, אָמַר: הַמָּקוֹם לֹא חָפֵץ בְּךָ, אֲנִי מָה אֶעֱשֶׂה לָךְ?
human_translation: What did he do? He selected six and he brought seventy-two slips [ pitakin ]. On seventy he wrote: Elder, and he left two blank. He mixed them and placed them in the box. He said to Come and draw your slips.
