Everyone whose hand drew up Elder, he said Heaven has already sanctified you. everyone whose hand drew up blank he said The Omnipresent does not desire you; what can I do for you?
llm_translation: He did? He clarified six six, and brought seventy and two notes. On seventy he wrote "elderly," and two he left blank. He mixed them and placed them in a basket. He said to them: Come and draw your notes! Whoever drew "elderly" said: Heaven has already sanctified you. Whoever drew a blank said: The Omnipresent is not pleased with you, what shall I do for you?

hebrew_text: כְּיוֹצֵא בַּדָּבָר אַתָּה אוֹמֵר: ״וְלָקַחְתָּ חֲמֵשֶׁת חֲמֵשֶׁת שְׁקָלִים לַגֻּלְגֹּלֶת״. אָמַר מֹשֶׁה: כֵּיצַד אֶעֱשֶׂה לָהֶן לְיִשְׂרָאֵל? אִם אוֹמַר לוֹ: תֵּן לִי פִּדְיוֹנְךָ וָצֵא, יֹאמַר לִי: כְּבָר פְּדָאַנִי בֶּן לֵוִי.
human_translation: You say similar to this you shall take five shekels per head” Moses said: How shall I do for the Jews? If I say to Give me your redemption and leave, he will say to me: A Levite already redeemed me;
llm_translation: As an expert Talmud scholar, I provide you with the word-for-word English translation of the Talmudic text you provided: Talmudic text: "As an example in this matter, you say: 'And you shall take five shekels for the gulgoleth.' Moses said: How shall I do this for the Israelites? If I say to him: Give me your ransom and leave, he will say to me: The son of Levi has already redeemed me." I hope this translation is helpful to you in your studies.

hebrew_text: מָה עָשָׂה? הֵבִיא עֶשְׂרִים וּשְׁנַיִם אֲלָפִים פִּיתְקִין, וְכָתַב עֲלֵיהֶן ״בֶּן לֵוִי״, וְעַל שְׁלֹשָׁה וְשִׁבְעִים וּמָאתַיִם כָּתַב עֲלֵיהֶן ״חֲמִשָּׁה שְׁקָלִים״. בְּלָלָן וּנְתָנָן בְּקַלְפִּי. אָמַר לָהֶן: טְלוּ פִּיתְקֵיכֶם. מִי שֶׁעָלָה בְּיָדוֹ ״בֶּן לֵוִי״, אָמַר לוֹ: כְּבָר פְּדָאֲךָ בֶּן לֵוִי. מִי שֶׁעָלָה בְּיָדוֹ ״חֲמֵשֶׁת שְׁקָלִים״, אָמַר לוֹ: תֵּן פִּדְיוֹנְךָ וָצֵא.
human_translation: What did he do? He brought 22,000 slips and he wrote on them: Levite, and on 273 he wrote: Five shekels. He mixed them up and placed them in a box. He said to them: Draw your slips. Everyone whose hand drew up Levite, he said to him: A Levite already redeemed you. Everyone whose hand drew up Five shekels, he said to him: Pay your redemption leave.
llm_translation: He did what? He brought twenty-two thousand receipts, and wrote on them "son of Levi," and on three hundred and seventy-two of them he wrote "five shekels." He mixed them up and placed them in a basket. He said to them: Draw your receipts. Whoever had "son of Levi" in his hand, he said to him: Levi's son, your redemption has already been paid. Whoever had "five shekels" in his hand, he said to him: Give your redemption and leave.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: בַּמַּחֲנֶה נִשְׁתַּיְּירוּ. בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁאָמַר לוֹ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לְמֹשֶׁה ״אֶסְפָה לִּי שִׁבְעִים אִישׁ״, אָמְרוּ אֶלְדָּד וּמֵידָד: אֵין אָנוּ רְאוּיִין לְאוֹתָהּ גְּדוּלָּה. אָמַר הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: הוֹאִיל וּמִיעַטְתֶּם עַצְמְכֶם, הֲרֵינִי מוֹסִיף גְּדוּלָּה עַל גְּדוּלַּתְכֶם. וּמָה גְּדוּלָּה הוֹסִיף לָהֶם? שֶׁהַנְּבִיאִים כּוּלָּן נִתְנַבְּאוּ וּפָסְקוּ, וְהֵם נִתְנַבְּאוּ וְלֹא פָּסְקוּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: remained in the camp, At the time that the Holy One, Blessed be He, said to Moses: Gather for me seventy Elders, Eldad and Medad said: We are not fitting for that greatness; The Holy One, Blessed be He, said: Since you have made yourselves humble, I will add greatness to your greatness. And what is greatness he added to them? that all of the prophets, prophesied and stopped but they prophesied and did not stop.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: "They remained in the camp." When the Holy One, blessed be He, said to Moses, "Gather for Me seventy men," Eldad and Medad said: "We are not worthy of that greatness." The Holy One, blessed be He, said: "Since you have diminished yourselves, I will add greatness upon your greatness." And what greatness did He add to them? That all the prophets prophesied and ceased, but they prophesied and did not cease.

hebrew_text: וּמָה נְבוּאָה נִתְנַבְּאוּ? אָמְרוּ: מֹשֶׁה מֵת, יְהוֹשֻׁעַ מַכְנִיס אֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל לָאָרֶץ. אַבָּא חָנִין אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: עַל עִסְקֵי שְׂלָיו הֵן מִתְנַבְּאִים: עֲלִי שְׂלָיו, עֲלִי שְׂלָיו.
human_translation: And what prophecy did they prophesy? They said: Moses will die, Joshua will bring the Jewish people into Eretz Abba Ḥanin says in the name of Rabbi Eliezer: They prophesied about the matter of the quail Arise quail, arise quail,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And what prophecy did they prophesy? They said: Moses died, Joshua brings Israel into the land. Abba Haninah says in the name of Rabbi Eliezer: They prophesy concerning his baskets: "Upon his baskets, upon his baskets."

hebrew_text: רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר: עַל עִסְקֵי גּוֹג וּמָגוֹג הָיוּ מִתְנַבְּאִין, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כֹּה אָמַר ה׳ אֱלֹהִים הַאַתָּה הוּא אֲשֶׁר דִּבַּרְתִּי בְּיָמִים קַדְמוֹנִים בְּיַד עֲבָדַי נְבִיאֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל הַנִּבְּאִים בַּיָּמִים הָהֵם שָׁנִים לְהָבִיא אֹתְךָ עֲלֵיהֶם וְגוֹ׳״. אַל תִּיקְרֵי ״שָׁנִים״ אֶלָּא ״שְׁנַיִם״. אֵילּוּ הֵן שְׁנַיִם נְבִיאִים שֶׁנִּתְנַבְּאוּ בְּפֶרֶק אֶחָד נְבוּאָה אַחַת? הֱוֵי אוֹמֵר: אֶלְדָּד וּמֵידָד.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman says: They were prophesying about the matter of Gog and Magog, as it is stated “So says the Lord God: Are you the one of whom I spoke in ancient days, through my servants, the prophets of Israel, who prophesied in those days for many years [ shanim ] that I would bring you against them?” Do not read “Years [ shanim ]”; rather, Two [ shenayim ]. And who are the two prophets who prophesied the same prophecy at the same time? You must say: Eldad and Medad.
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said: They were prophesying about the affairs of Gog and Magog, as it is stated: "Thus said the Lord God: Are you the one of whom I spoke in the olden days through My servants, the prophets of Israel, who prophesied in those days, for years, that I would bring you against them, etc." Do not read "years" but rather "two." Who are the two prophets who prophesied in one chapter, one prophecy? Say: Eldad and Medad.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: כׇּל הַנְּבִיאִים כּוּלָּן נִתְנַבְּאוּ וּפָסְקוּ, וְהֵן נִתְנַבְּאוּ וְלֹא פָּסְקוּ. מְנָא לַן דְּפָסְקוּ? אִילֵּימָא מִדִּכְתִיב: ״וַיִּתְנַבְּאוּ וְלֹא יָסָפוּ״? אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה: ״קוֹל גָּדוֹל וְלֹא יָסָף״ – הָכִי נָמֵי דְּלָא אוֹסֵיף הוּא? אֶלָּא דְּלָא פְּסַק הוּא!
human_translation: The Master says: All of the prophets prophesied and stopped, but prophesied and did not stop. From where do we that stopped If we say from that which is written “And they prophesied but they did so no more [ velo yasafu ]” But if that is so, a great voice, and it went on no more [ velo yasaf ]” so too that did not continue? Rather, that it did not stop,
llm_translation: Master said: All the prophets all of them prophesied and ceased, and they prophesied and did not cease. How do we know that they ceased? If you say because it is written: "And they prophesied and did not cease"? Rather, from now on: "A loud voice and did not cease" – this means that he will not add? Rather, it means that he did not cease!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, הָכָא כְּתִיב: ״וַיִּתְנַבְּאוּ״, הָתָם כְּתִיב: ״מִתְנַבְּאִים״. עֲדַיִין מִתְנַבְּאִים וְהוֹלְכִים.
human_translation: Rather, It is written here “They prophesied” it is written there: are prophesying they were continuously prophesying.
llm_translation: Rather, here it is written: "And they prophesied," there it is written: "prophesying." They are still prophesying and going.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר מֹשֶׁה מֵת, הַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב ״אֲדֹנִי מֹשֶׁה כְּלָאֵם״. אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר הָנָךְ תַּרְתֵּי, מַאי ״אֲדֹנִי מֹשֶׁה כְּלָאֵם״? דְּלָאו אוֹרַח אַרְעָא, דְּהָוֵה לֵיהּ כְּתַלְמִיד הַמּוֹרֶה הֲלָכָה לִפְנֵי רַבּוֹ.
human_translation: Granted, according to the one who says Moses will die, this is which is written My master Moses, imprison them” But according to the one who says those two what “My master Moses, imprison them”? because not proper conduct as they are like a student who teaches a halakha in his teacher’s presence,
llm_translation: In truth, according to the one who says Moses died, that is what is written, "The Lord buried Moses." But according to the one who says he is alive, what is "The Lord buried Moses"? It is not the way of the world, for he was like a student who presents a legal matter before his teacher.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר הָנָךְ תַּרְתֵּי, הַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב: ״מִי יִתֵּן״. אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר מֹשֶׁה מֵת, מֵינָח הֲוָה נִיחָא לֵיהּ? לָא סַיְּימוּהָ קַמֵּיהּ.
human_translation: Granted, according to the one who says those two this is which is written: Would But according to the one who says Moses will die would it have been satisfactory to Moses They did not conclude it before him.
llm_translation: In truth, according to the one who said "Here are two," that is what is written: "Who will give." But according to the one who said Moses died, was it pleasing for him to rest? They did not finish it before him.

hebrew_text: מַאי ״כְּלָאֵם״? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הַטֵּל עֲלֵיהֶן צׇרְכֵי צִיבּוּר, וְהֵן כָּלִין מֵאֵילֵיהֶן.
human_translation: What “Imprison them [ kela’em ]”? said to him: Place needs of the public upon them, and they will cease [ kalin ] on their own.
llm_translation: What is "Kela'em"? He said to him: Impose upon them the needs of the community, and they will be exempt from their own.

hebrew_text: מִנַּיִין לְהָבִיא עוֹד שְׁלֹשָׁה?
human_translation: From where to bring three more
llm_translation: From where do we bring three more?

hebrew_text: סוֹף סוֹף, לְרָעָה עַל פִּי שְׁנַיִם לָא מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ. אִי אַחַד עָשָׂר מְזַכִּין וּשְׁנֵים עָשָׂר מְחַיְּיבִין – אַכַּתִּי חַד הוּא. אִי עֲשָׂרָה מְזַכִּין וּשְׁלֹשָׁה עָשָׂר מְחַיְּיבִין – תְּלָתָא הָווּ. אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: אִי אַתָּה מוֹצֵא אֶלָּא בְּמוֹסִיפִין, וְדִבְרֵי הַכֹּל, וּבְסַנְהֶדְרִי גְּדוֹלָה, וְאַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה דְּאָמַר שִׁבְעִים.
human_translation: Ultimately, you do not find for evil according to two If eleven acquit and twelve convict, this is still one, if ten acquit and thirteen convict, they are three. Rabbi Abbahu says: You do not find except where they add And according to and in the Great Sanhedrin according to of Rabbi Yehuda, who says seventy
llm_translation: At the end, for evil, by the mouth of two, it is not forgotten. If one says "eleven acquit and twelve obligate" - it is as if he said "eleven." If ten acquit and thirteen obligate - they are three. Rabbi Abbahu said: If you find only in the additional members, and the words of all, and in the Great Sanhedrin, and according to the opinion of Rabbi Yehudah who said seventy.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: בְּמוֹסִיפִין עוֹשִׂין בֵּית דִּין שָׁקוּל לְכַתְּחִילָּה. פְּשִׁיטָא! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: הַאי דְּקָאָמַר ״אֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ״ כְּמַאן דְּאִיתֵיהּ דָּמֵי, וְאִי אָמַר מִילְּתָא – שָׁמְעִינַן לֵיהּ; קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דְּהַאי דְּקָאָמַר ״אֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ״ כְּמַאן דְּלֵיתֵיהּ דָּמֵי, וְאִי אָמַר טַעְמָא – לָא שָׁמְעִינַן לֵיהּ.
human_translation: And Rabbi Abbahu says: When they add create a court an even ab initio . obvious? Lest you say: This who says: I do not know, is as one who is there, and if he says something we listen to him teaches us that this who says: I do not know, is as one who is not there, and if he says a reason we do not listen to him.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Avahu said: In cases of adding, the court should initially lean towards leniency. It is obvious! What might you have thought? That when one says "I do not know," it is like someone who has knowledge, and if he says a matter - we listen to him; we learn that when one says "I do not know," it is like someone who does not have knowledge, and if he gives a reason - we do not listen to him.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא: סַנְהֶדְרִי שֶׁרָאוּ כּוּלָּן לְחוֹבָה – פּוֹטְרִין אוֹתוֹ. מַאי טַעְמָא? כֵּיוָן דִּגְמִירִי הֲלָנַת דִּין לְמֶעְבַּד לֵיהּ זְכוּתָא, וְהָנֵי תּוּ לָא חָזוּ לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rav Kahana says: a Sanhedrin where all saw to convict acquit him. What is the reasoning since is learned suspension of the trial to create acquittal. And those will not see further him,
llm_translation: Rav Kahana said: A Sanhedrin that all of them see for liability - they acquit him. What is the reason? Since they have learned to acquit, and these ones did not see for him.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אֵין מוֹשִׁיבִין בְּסַנְהֶדְרִי אֶלָּא בַּעֲלֵי קוֹמָה, וּבַעֲלֵי חׇכְמָה, וּבַעֲלֵי מַרְאֶה, וּבַעֲלֵי זִקְנָה, וּבַעֲלֵי כְשָׁפִים, וְיוֹדְעִים בְּשִׁבְעִים לָשׁוֹן – שֶׁלֹּא תְּהֵא סַנְהֶדְרִי שׁוֹמַעַת מִפִּי הַמְתוּרְגְּמָן.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: place on the Sanhedrin only of stature, and of wisdom, and of appearance, and of age And masters of sorcery, and know seventy languages that the Sanhedrin will not hear from the mouth of a translator
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: Only those of stature, wisdom, appearance, age, sorcery, and knowledgeable in seventy languages may sit in the Sanhedrin, so that the Sanhedrin does not rely on the interpreter's mouth.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: אֵין מוֹשִׁיבִין בְּסַנְהֶדְרִין אֶלָּא מִי שֶׁיּוֹדֵעַ לְטַהֵר אֶת הַשֶּׁרֶץ מִן הַתּוֹרָה. אָמַר רַב: אֲנִי אָדוּן וַאֲטַהֲרֶנּוּ.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Rav says: place on the Sanhedrin only one who knows to render a creeping animal pure by Torah law. Rav said: I will discuss and render it pure,
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: Only one who knows how to purify a creeping creature from the Torah may sit in the Sanhedrin. Rav said: I am a master and I will purify it.

hebrew_text: וּמָה נָחָשׁ שֶׁמֵּמִית וּמַרְבֶּה טוּמְאָה, טָהוֹר; שֶׁרֶץ שֶׁאֵינוֹ מֵמִית וּמַרְבֶּה טוּמְאָה, אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁיְּהֵא טָהוֹר? וְלָא הִיא, מִידֵּי דְּהָוֵה אַקּוֹץ בְּעָלְמָא.
human_translation: If a snake, which kills and increases impurity pure, a creeping animal that does not kill and increase impurity, isn’t it logical that it should be pure? But it is not so; just as it is with regard to an ordinary thorn,
llm_translation: And what about a snake that is deadly and increases impurity, is it pure; but a creeping thing that is not deadly and increases impurity, is it not fitting that it should be pure? But it is not so, because it is considered as if it were a thorn in the world.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: כׇּל עִיר שֶׁאֵין בָּהּ שְׁנַיִם לְדַבֵּר וְאֶחָד לִשְׁמוֹעַ, אֵין מוֹשִׁיבִין בָּהּ סַנְהֶדְרִי. וּבְבֵיתֵּר הֲווֹ שְׁלֹשָׁה, וּבְיַבְנֶה אַרְבָּעָה: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, וְשִׁמְעוֹן הַתִּימְנִי דָּן לִפְנֵיהֶם בַּקַּרְקַע.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Rav says: any city that does not have two to speak and one to listen they do not place Sanhedrin And in Beitar there were three and in Yavne four, Rabbi Eliezer, and Rabbi Yehoshua, and Rabbi Akiva, and Shimon HaTimni, deliberate before on the ground,
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: Any city that does not have two to speak and one to listen, a Sanhedrin is not established in it. In Beit She'arim, there were three, and in Yavneh, there were four: Rabbi Eliezer, Rabbi Yehoshua, Rabbi Akiva, and Shimon HaTzaddik would sit before them on the ground.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: שְׁלִישִׁית – חֲכָמָה, רְבִיעִית – אֵין לְמַעְלָה הֵימֶנָּה. הוּא דְּאָמַר כִּי הַאי תַּנָּא, דְּתַנְיָא: שְׁנִיָּה – חֲכָמָה, שְׁלִישִׁית – אֵין לְמַעְלָה הֵימֶנָּה.
human_translation: raises an objection A third, a wise a fourth there is no above it, states in accordance with the following tanna , as it is taught a second is wise; a third, there is no above it.
llm_translation: The Tanna raises an objection: "The third - wisdom, the fourth - there is nothing above it." This is as the Tanna taught: "The second - wisdom, the third - there is nothing above it."

hebrew_text: לְמֵידִין לִפְנֵי חֲכָמִים – לֵוִי מֵרַבִּי. דָּנִין לִפְנֵי חֲכָמִים – שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן עַזַּאי, וְשִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן זוֹמָא, וְחָנָן הַמִּצְרִי, וַחֲנַנְיָא בֶּן חֲכִינַאי. רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק מַתְנֵי חֲמִשָּׁה: שִׁמְעוֹן, שִׁמְעוֹן, וְשִׁמְעוֹן, חָנָן, וַחֲנַנְיָה.
human_translation: It was learned from the Sages, Levi from Rabbi deliberated before the Sages, Shimon ben Azzai, and Shimon ben Zoma, and Ḥanan the Egyptian, and Ḥananya ben Ḥakhinai. Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak teach five Shimon Shimon and Shimon Ḥanan and Ḥananya
llm_translation: Learning before sages - Levi from Rabbi. Judging before sages - Shimon ben Azai, Shimon ben Zoma, Hanan the Egyptian, and Hananiah ben Hakinai. Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak teaches five: Shimon, Shimon, and Shimon, Hanan, and Hananiah.

hebrew_text: רַבּוֹתֵינוּ שֶׁבְּבָבֶל – רַב וּשְׁמוּאֵל. רַבּוֹתֵינוּ שֶׁבְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל – רַבִּי אַבָּא. דַּיָּינֵי גוֹלָה – קַרְנָא. דַּיָּינֵי דְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל – רַבִּי אַמֵּי וְרַבִּי אַסִּי. דַּיָּינֵי דְּפוּמְבְּדִיתָא – רַב פָּפָּא בַּר שְׁמוּאֵל. דַּיָּינֵי דִּנְהַרְדְּעָא – רַב אַדָּא בַּר מִנְיוֹמֵי. סָבֵי דְּסוּרָא – רַב הוּנָא וְרַב חִסְדָּא. סָבֵי דְּפוּמְבְּדִיתָא – רַב יְהוּדָה וְרַב עֵינָא. חֲרִיפֵי דְּפוּמְבְּדִיתָא – עֵיפָה וַאֲבִימִי בְּנֵי רַחֲבָה. אָמוֹרָאֵי דְּפוּמְבְּדִיתָא – רַבָּה וְרַב יוֹסֵף. אָמוֹרָאֵי דִּנְהַרְדָּעֵי – רַב חָמָא.
human_translation: Our Rabbis that are in Babylonia, Rav and Shmuel. Our Rabbis that are in Eretz Yisrael, Rabbi Abba. The judges of the Diaspora, Karna. The judges of Eretz Yisrael, Rabbi Ami and Rabbi Asi. The judges of Pumbedita, Rav Pappa bar Shmuel, The judges of Neharde’a, Rav Adda bar Minyumi. The Elders of Sura, Rav Huna and Rav Ḥisda, The Elders of Pumbedita, Rav Yehuda and Rav Eina. The sharp ones of Pumbedita Eifa and Avimi, the sons of Raḥava. The amora’im of Pumbedita, Rabba and Rav Yosef, The amora’im of Neharde’a, Rav Ḥama.
llm_translation: Our Rabbis in Babylonia - Rav and Shmuel. Our Rabbis in the Land of Israel - Rabbi Abba. The judges of exile - Karnah. The judges of the Land of Israel - Rabbi Ammi and Rabbi Assi. The judges of Pumbedita - Rav Papa, son of Shmuel. The judges of Nehardea - Rav Adda, son of Minyomi. The elders of Sura - Rav Huna and Rav Hisda. The elders of Pumbedita - Rav Yehuda and Rav Eina. The sages of Pumbedita - Eipha and Avimi, sons of Rachabah. The Amoraim of Pumbedita - Rabba and Rav Yosef. The Amoraim of Nehardea - Rav Hama.

hebrew_text: נְהַרְבְּלָאֵי מַתְנוּ – רָמֵי בַּר בְּרַבִּי. אָמְרִי בֵּי רַב – רַב הוּנָא. וְהָאָמַר רַב הוּנָא: ״אָמְרִי בֵּי רַב״! אֶלָּא, רַב הַמְנוּנָא. אָמְרִי בְּמַעְרְבָא – רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה. שְׁלַחוּ מִתָּם – רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר חֲנִינָא. מַחֲכוּ עֲלַהּ בְּמַעְרְבָא – רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר.
human_translation: of Neharbela taught, Rami bar Berabi, They say the school of Rav, Rav Huna. But doesn’t Rav Huna say They say the school of Rav? Rather, Rav Hamnuna. They say in the West, Rabbi Yirmeya; They sent from there, Rabbi Yosei bar Ḥanina; They laughed at it in the West, Rabbi Elazar
llm_translation: The river Bilai said - Ramei son of Rabbi. The house of Rav said - Rav Huna. But didn't Rav Huna say: "The house of Rav"! Rather, Rav Hamnuna. They said in the West - Rabbi Yirmeya. They sent from there - Rabbi Yosei bar Chanina. They waited for him in the West - Rabbi Elazar.

hebrew_text: וְהָא שְׁלַחוּ מִתָּם: לְדִבְרֵי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר חֲנִינָא! אֶלָּא אֵיפוֹךְ: שְׁלַחוּ מִתָּם – רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר; מַחֲכוּ עֲלַהּ בְּמַעְרְבָא – רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר חֲנִינָא.
human_translation: But They sent from there According to the statement of Rabbi Yosei bar Ḥanina. Rather, reverse They sent from there, Rabbi Elazar, They laughed at it in the West, Rabbi Yosei bar Ḥanina
llm_translation: And this case of sending a messenger is according to the words of Rabbi Yosei bar Chanina! Rather, the opposite: the one who sent the messenger is Rabbi Elazar; they waited for him in the west - Rabbi Yosei bar Chanina.

hebrew_text: וְכַמָּה יְהֵא בָּעִיר וִיהֵא רְאוּיָה לְסַנְהֶדְרִין? מֵאָה וְעֶשְׂרִים וְכוּ׳. מֵאָה וְעֶשְׂרִים מַאי עֲבִידְתַּיְיהוּ? עֶשְׂרִים וּשְׁלֹשָׁה כְּנֶגֶד סַנְהֶדְרִי קְטַנָּה, וְשָׁלֹשׁ שׁוּרוֹת שֶׁל עֶשְׂרִים וּשְׁלֹשָׁה – הֲרֵי תִּשְׁעִים וְתַרְתֵּי, וַעֲשָׂרָה בַּטְלָנִין שֶׁל בֵּית הַכְּנֶסֶת – הֲרֵי מְאָה וּתְרֵי.
human_translation: And how many be in the city for to be eligible for Sanhedrin? 120 What is the relevance of 120? 23 correspond to lesser Sanhedrin, and three rows of 23 is 92 And 10 idlers of the synagogue, would be 102.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "And how many should there be in the city that is fit for the Sanhedrin? One hundred and twenty, etc. What is the purpose of one hundred and twenty? Twenty-three opposite the lesser Sanhedrin, and twenty-three rows of twenty-three - behold ninety-two, and ten inactive members of the synagogue - behold one hundred and twelve."

hebrew_text: וּשְׁנֵי סוֹפְרִים, וּשְׁנֵי חַזָּנִין, וּשְׁנֵי בַּעֲלֵי דִינִין, וּשְׁנֵי עֵדִים, וּשְׁנֵי זוֹמְמִין, וּשְׁנֵי זוֹמְמֵי זוֹמְמִין – הֲרֵי מְאָה וְאַרְבֵּיסַר.
human_translation: And two scribes and two bailiffs, and two litigants And two witnesses and two conspiring and two conspiring conspiring there are 114
llm_translation: Two scribes, two cantors, two judges, two witnesses, two conspirators, and two false witnesses - total one hundred and twenty.

hebrew_text: וְתַנְיָא: כׇּל עִיר שֶׁאֵין בָּהּ עֲשָׂרָה דְּבָרִים הַלָּלוּ אֵין תַּלְמִיד חָכָם רַשַּׁאי לָדוּר בְּתוֹכָהּ: בֵּית דִּין מַכִּין וְעוֹנְשִׁין, וְקוּפָּה שֶׁל צְדָקָה נִגְבֵּית בִּשְׁנַיִם וּמִתְחַלֶּקֶת בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה, וּבֵית הַכְּנֶסֶת, וּבֵית הַמֶּרְחָץ, וּבֵית הַכִּסֵּא, רוֹפֵא, וְאוּמָּן, וְלַבְלָר, וְטַבָּח, וּמְלַמֵּד תִּינוֹקוֹת. מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אָמְרוּ: אַף מִינֵי פֵירָא, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁמִּינֵי פֵירָא מְאִירִין אֶת הָעֵינַיִם.
human_translation: And is taught A Torah scholar is not permitted to reside in any city that does not have these ten things: A court that flog and punish and fund are collected by two and distributed by three, And a synagogue; and a bathhouse; and bathroom; a doctor; and a bloodletter; and a scribe velavlar and slaughterer; and a teacher of young children. They said in the name of Rabbi Akiva: also varieties of fruit, because varieties of fruit illuminate the eyes.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it was taught in a Baraita: Any city that does not have these ten things, a Torah scholar is not permitted to reside in it: a court that administers corporal and capital punishment, a charity fund collected by two and distributed by three, a synagogue, a bathhouse, a restroom, a doctor, a craftsman, a teacher of young children. In the name of Rabbi Akiva they said: Even types of wild figs, because types of wild figs illuminate the eyes. English translation:

hebrew_text: רַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה אוֹמֵר וְכוּ׳. תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי אוֹמֵר:
human_translation: Rabbi Neḥemya says: is taught Rabbi says:
llm_translation: Rabbi Nechemiah says, and so forth. It was taught: Rabbi says:

hebrew_text: מָאתַיִם וְשִׁבְעִים וְשִׁבְעָה.
llm_translation: Two hundred and seventy-seven.

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא, רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: מָאתַיִם שִׁבְעִים וּשְׁמֹנָה! לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא – רַבִּי יְהוּדָה, הָא – רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: But isn’t it taught Rabbi says: 278? not difficult. This Rabbi Yehuda, this the Rabbis,
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates to: "And it was taught: Rabbi says: Two hundred seventy-eight! It is not difficult: here - Rabbi Yehuda, here - the Rabbis."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״וְשַׂמְתָּ עֲלֵיהֶם שָׂרֵי אֲלָפִים שָׂרֵי מֵאוֹת שָׂרֵי חֲמִשִּׁים וְשָׂרֵי עֲשָׂרֹת״. ״שָׂרֵי אֲלָפִים״ – שֵׁשׁ מֵאוֹת, ״שָׂרֵי מֵאוֹת״ – שֵׁשֶׁת אֲלָפִים, ״שָׂרֵי חֲמִשִּׁים״ – שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר אֶלֶף, ״שָׂרֵי עֲשָׂרוֹת״ – שֵׁשֶׁת רִיבּוֹא. נִמְצְאוּ דַּיָּינֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל שִׁבְעַת רִיבּוֹא וּשְׁמוֹנַת אֲלָפִים וְשֵׁשׁ מֵאוֹת.
human_translation: The Sages taught: “And place over them ministers of thousands, ministers of hundreds, ministers of fifties, and ministers of tens” ministers of thousands 600, ministers of hundreds 6,000; ministers of fifties, 12,000, ministers of tens, 60,000. it is found judges of the Jewish people 78,600,
llm_translation: The Sages taught: "And you shall appoint over them chiefs of thousands, chiefs of hundreds, chiefs of fifties, and chiefs of tens." "Chiefs of thousands" - six hundred, "chiefs of hundreds" - six thousand, "chiefs of fifties" - twelve thousand, "chiefs of tens" - sixty thousand. The total number of leaders of Israel was found to be seven hundred, eight thousand, and six hundred.

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ דִּינֵי מָמוֹנוֹת.
llm_translation: The judgment of monetary matters is deferred upon you.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל דָּן וְדָנִין אוֹתוֹ, מֵעִיד וּמְעִידִין אוֹתוֹ, חוֹלֵץ וְחוֹלְצִין לְאִשְׁתּוֹ, וּמְיַיבְּמִין אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ. אֲבָל הוּא אֵינוֹ מְיַיבֵּם, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוּא אָסוּר בָּאַלְמָנָה.
human_translation: High Priest judges and judge him testifies and testify concerning him. He performs ḥalitza and performs ḥalitza with his wife; and consummates levirate marriage with his wife. But he does not consummate levirate marriage because it is prohibited for him to a widow
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: A Kohen Gadol judges and is judged, testifies and is testified against, performs chalitzah and receives chalitzah for his wife, and performs yibum with his wife. However, he does not perform yibum, because he is prohibited from marrying a widow.

hebrew_text: מֵת לוֹ מֵת, אֵינוֹ יוֹצֵא אַחַר הַמִּטָּה, אֶלָּא הֵן נִכְסִין וְהוּא נִגְלֶה, הֵן נִגְלִין וְהוּא נִכְסֶה, וְיוֹצֵא עִמָּהֶן עַד פֶּתַח שַׁעַר הָעִיר, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר.
human_translation: of dies, he does not follow the bier Rather, are concealed he is revealed they are revealed, he is concealed, and he goes out with them until the entrance of the gate of the city, the statement of Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: Deceased to him deceased, not he goes out after the bed, rather they are revealed and he is concealed, they are concealed and he is revealed, and he goes out with them until the entrance of the city gate, the words of Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אֵינוֹ יוֹצֵא מִן הַמִּקְדָּשׁ, מִשּׁוּם שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּמִן הַמִּקְדָּשׁ לֹא יֵצֵא״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: He does not emerge from the Temple as it is stated: “And from the Temple he shall not emerge
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehudah says: he does not go out from the Temple, because it is stated: "And from the Temple he shall not go out."

hebrew_text: וּכְשֶׁהוּא מְנַחֵם אֲחֵרִים, דֶּרֶךְ כׇּל הָעָם עוֹבְרִין בְּזֶה אַחַר זֶה, וְהַמְמוּנֶּה מְמַצְּעוֹ בֵּינוֹ לְבֵין הָעָם. וּכְשֶׁהוּא מִתְנַחֵם מֵאֲחֵרִים, כׇּל הָעָם אוֹמְרִים לוֹ: אֲנַחְנוּ כַּפָּרָתְךָ, וְהוּא אוֹמֵר לָהֶן: תִּתְבָּרְכוּ מִן הַשָּׁמַיִם. וּכְשֶׁמַּבְרִין אוֹתוֹ, כׇּל הָעָם מְסוּבִּין עַל הָאָרֶץ, וְהוּא מֵיסֵב עַל הַסַּפְסָל.
human_translation: And when he consoles others way of all the people they pass by one after another and the appointed stands in the middle, between and the people. And when he is consoled by others all the people say to him: We are your atonement. And he says to them: May you be blessed from Heaven. And when they comfort him with the meal all the people recline on the ground and he reclines on the bench
llm_translation: When he consoles others, it is the way of all the people to pass by one after the other, and the appointed one sits in the middle between him and the people. And when he is consoled by others, all the people say to him: "We are your atonement," and he says to them: "May you be blessed from heaven." And when they bless him, all the people are seated on the ground, and he sits on a stool.

hebrew_text: הַמֶּלֶךְ לֹא דָּן, וְלֹא דָּנִין אוֹתוֹ, לֹא מֵעִיד וְלֹא מְעִידִין אוֹתוֹ, לֹא חוֹלֵץ וְלֹא חוֹלְצִין לְאִשְׁתּוֹ, לֹא מְיַיבֵּם וְלֹא מְיַיבְּמִין לְאִשְׁתּוֹ. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אִם רָצָה לַחֲלוֹץ אוֹ לְיַיבֵּם – זָכוּר לַטּוֹב. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: אֵין שׁוֹמְעִין לוֹ.
human_translation: The king does not judge and do not judge him, he does not testify and do not testify concerning him, he does not perform ḥalitza and does not perform ḥalitza with his wife, he does not consummate levirate marriage and does not consummate levirate marriage with his wife, Rabbi Yehuda says: If he desired to perform ḥalitza or to consummate levirate marriage, remembered for good, said to him: They do not listen to him
llm_translation: The king does not judge, and he is not judged, he does not testify, and he is not testified about, he does not divorce, and they do not divorce for his wife, he does not perform levirate marriage, and they do not perform levirate marriage for his wife. Rabbi Yehuda says: If he wants to divorce or perform levirate marriage - it is preferable to be male. They said to him: We do not listen to him.

hebrew_text: וְאֵין נוֹשְׂאִין אַלְמְנָתוֹ, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: נוֹשֵׂא הַמֶּלֶךְ אַלְמְנָתוֹ שֶׁל מֶלֶךְ, שֶׁכֵּן מָצִינוּ בְּדָוִד שֶׁנָּשָׂא אַלְמְנָתוֹ שֶׁל שָׁאוּל, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וָאֶתְּנָה לְךָ אֶת בֵּית אֲדֹנֶיךָ וְאֶת נְשֵׁי אֲדֹנֶיךָ בְּחֵיקֶךָ״.
human_translation: And no one may marry widow, Rabbi Yehuda says: king may marry the widow of a king, as we found that David married the widow of Saul, as it is stated: “And I have given you the house of your master and the wives of your master in your bosom”
llm_translation: And one does not marry his brother's widow, Rabbi Yehuda says: A king marries the widow of another king, as we find with David who married the widow of Saul, as it is said: "And I gave you the house of your master and the wives of your master into your arms."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל דָּן. פְּשִׁיטָא! דָּנִין אוֹתוֹ אִיצְטְרִיכָא לֵיהּ. הָא נָמֵי פְּשִׁיטָא: אִי לָא דָּיְינִינַן לֵיהּ, אִיהוּ הֵיכִי דָּיֵין? וְהָכְתִיב ״הִתְקוֹשְׁשׁוּ וָקוֹשּׁוּ״, וְאָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: קְשֹׁט עַצְמְךָ וְאַחַר כָּךְ קְשֹׁט אֲחֵרִים.
human_translation: High Priest judges obvious? It was necessary for judge him, This also obvious; if do not judge him, how can he judge But isn’t it written: “Gather yourselves together, yea, gather together [ hitkosheshu vakoshu ]” and Reish Lakish says: Adorn [ kashet ] yourself and then adorn others,
llm_translation: Gemara: Gedaliah Kohen judges. Obviously! We judge him, it is necessary for him. This is also obvious: if we do not judge him, how will he be judged? And it is written, "Strengthen yourself and then strengthen others," and Reish Lakish said: Adorn yourself first, and only then adorn others.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, אַיְּידֵי דְּקָא בָּעֵי לְמִיתְנֵי מֶלֶךְ לֹא דָּן וְלֹא דָּנִין אוֹתוֹ, תְּנָא נָמֵי כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל דָּן וְדָנִין. וְאִי בָּעֵית אֵימָא, הָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן כִּדְתַנְיָא: כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל שֶׁהָרַג אֶת הַנֶּפֶשׁ בְּמֵזִיד – נֶהֱרָג, בְּשׁוֹגֵג – גּוֹלֶה, וְעוֹבֵר עַל עֲשֵׂה וְעַל לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה, וַהֲרֵי הוּא כְּהֶדְיוֹט לְכׇל דְּבָרָיו.
human_translation: Rather, since wants to teach king does not judge and do not judge him, he also taught High Priest judges and judge him. And if you wish, say this teaches us as it is taught A High Priest who killed a person intentionally is killed; unintentionally, he is exiled and he transgresses a positive mitzva and a prohibition, and he is like an ordinary concerning all of his
llm_translation: Rather, since he seeks to establish that a king does not judge and is not judged, a Tanna taught: Just as the High Priest judges and is judged. And if you wish, I can say: This is what he meant to teach us, as it is taught: A High Priest who intentionally kills a person – is put to death; if unintentionally – he goes into exile. And if he transgresses a positive commandment or a negative commandment, he is like an ordinary person in all respects.

hebrew_text: בְּמֵזִיד נֶהֱרָג – פְּשִׁיטָא! בְּשׁוֹגֵג גּוֹלֶה אִיצְטְרִיכָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: intentionally is killed. obvious? It was necessary for it unintentionally, he is exiled,
llm_translation: Intentionally one is killed - obvious! Unintentionally one is exiled, this is necessary for him.

hebrew_text: הָא נָמֵי פְּשִׁיטָא! אִיצְטְרִיךְ, סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: הוֹאִיל וּכְתִיב ״וְיָשַׁב בָּהּ עַד מוֹת הַכֹּהֵן הַגָּדֹל״, אֵימָא: כֹּל דְּאִית לֵיהּ תַּקַּנְתָּא בַּחֲזָרָה – לִיגְלֵי, דְּלֵית לֵיהּ תַּקַּנְתָּא בַּחֲזָרָה – לָא לִיגְלֵי, דִּתְנַן:
human_translation: This also obvious. It was necessary enter your mind to say: Since it is written “And he should dwell in it until the death of the High Priest” say: Anyone for whom there is a rectification by returning is exiled, for whom there is no rectification by returning is not exiled. as we learned
llm_translation: Here is the word-for-word English translation of the Talmudic text: הָא - This נָמֵי - is a good פְּשִׁיטָא - inference! אִיצְטְרִיךְ - It is necessary, סָלְקָא - for דַּעְתָּךְ - your opinion אָמֵינָא - I say: הוֹאִיל - Since וּכְתִיב - it is written ״וְיָשַׁב בָּהּ עַד מוֹת הַכֹּהֵן הַגָּדֹל״ - "and he shall dwell in it until the death of the High Priest," אֵימָא - I might say: כֹּל - anyone דְּאִית - who has לֵיהּ - it תַּקַּנְתָּא - a remedy בַּחֲזָרָה - in return – לִיגְלֵי - let him go out, דְּלֵית - but if he does not have לֵיהּ - it תַּקַּנְתָּא - a remedy בַּחֲזָרָה - in return – לָא - he should not go out, דִּתְנַן - as we learned:

hebrew_text: הַהוֹרֵג כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל, אוֹ כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל שֶׁהָרַג אֶת הַנֶּפֶשׁ – אֵינוֹ יוֹצֵא מִשָּׁם לְעוֹלָם; אֵימָא לָא לִיגְלֵי – קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן. וְאֵימָא הָכִי נָמֵי? אָמַר קְרָא ״לָנוּס שָׁמָּה כׇּל רֹצֵחַ״ – אֲפִילּוּ כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל בַּמַּשְׁמָע.
human_translation: one who kills a High Priest or a High Priest who killed a person, never departs from I will say is not exiled teaches us say that indeed verse states “That every manslayer may flee there” even a High Priest is indicated
llm_translation: The one who kills the High Priest, or a High Priest who killed a soul - he does not leave there forever; say it should not be revealed - it is heard for us. And say it is so? The verse says, "for the murderer to flee there" - even a High Priest is included in the implication.

hebrew_text: עוֹבֵר עַל עֲשֵׂה וְעַל לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה. לָא סַגִּי דְּלָא עָבַר? הָכִי קָאָמַר: אִם עָבַר עַל עֲשֵׂה וְעַל לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה, הֲרֵי הוּא כְּהֶדְיוֹט לְכׇל דְּבָרָיו.
human_translation: transgresses a positive mitzva and a prohibition. not possible that he doesn’t transgress This is saying: if he transgressed a positive mitzva and a prohibition, he is like an ordinary concerning all of his
llm_translation: Translating the Talmudic text: "He transgresses a positive commandment and a negative commandment. Is it not sufficient that he transgressed? This is what he is saying: If one transgresses a positive commandment and a negative commandment, he is considered like an ordinary person in all his matters."

hebrew_text: פְּשִׁיטָא! סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא, הוֹאִיל וּתְנַן: אֵין דָּנִין לֹא אֶת הַשֵּׁבֶט וְלֹא אֶת נְבִיא הַשֶּׁקֶר וְלֹא אֶת כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל אֶלָּא עַל פִּי בֵּית דִּין שֶׁל שִׁבְעִים וְאֶחָד, וְאָמַר רַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה: ״כׇּל הַדָּבָר הַגָּדֹל יָבִיאוּ אֵלֶיךָ״ – דְּבָרָיו שֶׁל גָּדוֹל, אֵימָא כׇּל דְּבָרָיו שֶׁל גָּדוֹל, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: obvious? enter your mind to say since we learned judges tribe or a false prophet, or a High Priest, only on the basis of a court of seventy-one and Rav Adda bar Ahava says “every great matter they shall bring unto you” matters of a great say all the matters of a great teaches us
llm_translation: It is obvious! The conclusion of your reasoning I say, since we learned: One does not judge neither the tribe, nor the false prophet, nor the high priest except by the court of seventy-one, and Rav Adda bar Ahava said: "All great matters shall be brought to you" – his words, those of the great one, I say all his words, those of the great one, are being implied to us.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא הָכִי נָמֵי: מִי כְּתִיב דִּבְרֵי גָדוֹל? ״הַדָּבָר הַגָּדֹל״ כְּתִיב, דָּבָר גָּדוֹל מַמָּשׁ.
human_translation: But say indeed, Is it written: The matters of a great person? great matter” is written, actually a great matter,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And why not say as follows: Who is it written "words of greatness"? "The great matter" is written, a truly great matter. English translation: And why not say as follows: Who is it written "words of greatness"? "The great matter" is written, a truly great matter.

hebrew_text: מֵעִיד וּמְעִידִין אוֹתוֹ. מֵעִיד? וְהָתַנְיָא: ״וְהִתְעַלַּמְתָּ״ – פְּעָמִים שֶׁאַתָּה מִתְעַלֵּם, וּפְעָמִים שֶׁאִי אַתָּה מִתְעַלֵּם. הָא כֵּיצַד?
human_translation: testifies and testify concerning him. He testifies? But isn’t it taught “and ignore times when you ignore and times when you do not ignore How so?
llm_translation: He testifies and they testify about him. He testifies? And it was taught: "And you have ignored" - there are times when you ignore, and there are times when you do not ignore. How so?

hebrew_text: כֹּהֵן וְהוּא בְּבֵית הַקְּבָרוֹת, זָקֵן וְאֵינָהּ לְפִי כְּבוֹדוֹ, אוֹ שֶׁהָיְתָה מְלָאכָה שֶׁלּוֹ מְרוּבָּה מִשֶּׁל חֲבֵירוֹ – לְכָךְ נֶאֱמַר ״וְהִתְעַלַּמְתָּ״.
human_translation: a priest, and is in the cemetery, an elderly person and it is not with his dignity or his work, is greater than of the other, Therefore, it is stated: “And ignore
llm_translation: Priest and he in cemetery, old and not according to his honor, or that was work of his more than of his fellow - therefore it says "and you shall disregard."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: מֵעִיד לַמֶּלֶךְ. וְהָתְנַן: לֹא דָּן וְלֹא דָּנִין אוֹתוֹ, לֹא מֵעִיד וְלֹא מְעִידִין אוֹתוֹ? אֶלָּא אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: מֵעִיד לְבֶן מֶלֶךְ. בֶּן מֶלֶךְ הֶדְיוֹט הוּא!
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: testifies about a king, But didn’t we learn does not judge and is not judged, he does not testify and do not testify concerning him? Rather, Rabbi Zeira said: testifies about a son of a king. The son of a king is an ordinary
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: "He testifies for the king." But didn't we learn: "One does not judge him, and one does not have others judge him, one does not testify, and one does not have others testify for him?" Rather, Rabbi Zeira said: "He testifies for the son of the king. The son of the king is a commoner!"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, מֵעִיד בִּפְנֵי הַמֶּלֶךְ. וְהָא אֵין מוֹשִׁיבִין מֶלֶךְ בְּסַנְהֶדְרִין! מִשּׁוּם יְקָרָא דְּכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל אֲתָא וְיָתֵיב. מְקַבְּלִי נִיהֲלֵיהּ לְסָהֲדוּתֵיהּ, קָאֵי הוּא וְאָזֵיל, וּמְעַיְּינִינָא לֵיהּ אֲנַן בְּדִינֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rather, he testifies before the king, But a king is not seated on the Sanhedrin? Due to the honor of High Priest, comes and sits they receive his testimony, he rises and goes, and we deliberate about the case.
llm_translation: Rather, he testifies before the king. But isn't a king not seated in the Sanhedrin! Due to the honor of the High Priest, he comes and sits. They accept his testimony for his testimony, he stands and leaves, and we examine his judgment.

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא: אֵין מוֹשִׁיבִין מֶלֶךְ בַּסַּנְהֶדְרִין, וְלֹא מֶלֶךְ וְכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל בְּעִיבּוּר שָׁנָה. מֶלֶךְ בַּסַּנְהֶדְרִין – דִּכְתִיב: ״לֹא תַעֲנֶה עַל רִב״ – לֹא תַעֲנֶה עַל רַב.
human_translation: the itself: A king is not seated on the Sanhedrin, nor a king or a High Priest on intercalating the year. a king on the Sanhedrin, as it is written: “Do not answer in a cause [ riv ]” Do not answer to a great person [ rav ].
llm_translation: Body: One does not establish a king in the Sanhedrin, nor a king and a high priest in the same year. A king in the Sanhedrin - as it is written: "You shall not curse a ruler" - you shall not curse a rabbi.

hebrew_text: לֹא מֶלֶךְ וְכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל בְּעִיבּוּר שָׁנָה. מֶלֶךְ – מִשּׁוּם אַפְסַנְיָא, כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל – מִשּׁוּם צִינָּה.
human_translation: Nor a king or a High Priest on intercalating the year. A king due to sustenance A High Priest due to the cold.
llm_translation: Not king and high priest in the same year. King - because of the crown, high priest - because of the breastplate.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ, שַׁתָּא בָּתַר יַרְחָא אָזֵיל. אִינִי? וְהָא הָנָךְ שְׁלֹשָׁה רוֹעֵי בָקָר דַּהֲווֹ קָיְימִי, וְשַׁמְעִינְהוּ רַבָּנַן דְּקָאָמְרִי:
human_translation: Rav Pappa says: Learn from the year follows the months, Is that so? But those three cattle herders that were standing and the Sages heard them saying
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: Understand from it, six months go by. Is it not so? But there were three cow herders who were standing, and the Rabbis heard them saying:

hebrew_text: חַד אָמַר: אִם בַּכִּיר וְלַקִּישׁ כַּחֲדָא יֵינֵץ – דֵּין הוּא אֲדָר, וְאִם לָאו – לֵית דֵּין אֲדָר. וְחַד אָמַר: אִם תּוֹר בִּצְפַר בִּתְלַג יְמוּת, וּבְטִיהֲרָא בְּטוּל תְּאֵינָה יִדְמוֹךְ יַשְׁלַח מַשְׁכֵּיהּ – דֵּין הוּא אֲדָר, וְאִם לָאו – לֵית דֵּין אֲדָר. וְחַד אָמַר: אִם קִידּוּם תַּקִּיף לַחֲדָא יְהֵא, יִפַּח בְּלוֹעָךְ נָפֵיק לְקִיבְלֵיהּ – דֵּין הוּא אֲדָר, וְאִם לָאו – לֵית דֵּין אֲדָר. וְעַבְּרוּהָ רַבָּנַן לְהַהִיא שַׁתָּא.
human_translation: One said: If the first grains and the late-ripening grains sprout at the same that is Adar, but if not, that is not Adar And one said: If an ox dies in the morning in the snow, and at noon in the shade of a fig tree it sleeps, to strip off its skin that is Adar, but if not, that is not Adar. And one said: If there is a very strong east wind, you blow with your jaw goes out toward it that is Adar, but if not, that is not Adar. And the Sages intercalated that year.
llm_translation: One said: If the elder and Lakish are in agreement, it is a valid judgment; but if not, it is not a valid judgment. And one said: If an ox gores in Zafar and kills in Telag, and in Tahara a virgin is defiled, he shall be liable to pay the fine - it is a valid judgment; but if not, it is not a valid judgment. And one said: If they have prepared a dish for one, let him blow on it to receive it; if it comes out of his mouth, it is a valid judgment; but if not, it is not a valid judgment. And the Rabbis passed by that place.

hebrew_text: וְתִסְבְּרָא רַבָּנַן אַרָעֲווֹתָא סְמוּךְ? אֶלָּא, רַבָּנַן אַחוּשְׁבָּנַיְיהוּ סְמוּךְ, וְרוֹעֵי בָקָר אִיסְתַּיּוֹעֵי הוּא דְּאִיסְתַּיַּיעָא מִילְּתַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: And you understand Sages relied on cattle herders Rather, the Sages relied on their own calculations, and cattle herders were supported as their statements were supported
llm_translation: The sages thought, is the land of Aravot adjacent? Rather, the sages themselves are adjacent, and the cattle herders are the ones who benefit from their adjacency.

hebrew_text: חוֹלֵץ וְחוֹלְצִין כּוּ׳. קָא פָּסֵיק וְתָנֵי, לָא שְׁנָא מִן הָאֵירוּסִין וְלָא שְׁנָא מִן הַנִּישּׂוּאִין. בִּשְׁלָמָא מִן הַנִּישּׂוּאִין, הָוֵי עֲשֵׂה וְלֹא תַעֲשֶׂה -
human_translation: performs ḥalitza and performs ḥalitza categorically teaches is no difference from betrothal and no difference from a marriage Granted, from marriage, there is a positive mitzva: and a prohibition:
llm_translation: Plucking and pluckers, like. It interrupted and taught, not different from betrothals and not different from marriages. Understandably from marriages, it is a positive commandment and a negative commandment -

hebrew_text: וְאֵין עֲשֵׂה דּוֹחֶה לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה וַעֲשֵׂה. אֶלָּא מִן הָאֵירוּסִין אַמַּאי? יָבֹא עֲשֵׂה וְיִדְחֶה לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה!
human_translation: and a positive mitzva does not override a prohibition and a positive mitzva. But from betrothal, why positive mitzva come and override the prohibition.
llm_translation: "And a positive commandment does not override a negative commandment to both do and not do. But from where do we derive this regarding betrothal? Let the positive commandment come and push aside the negative commandment not to do!"

hebrew_text: גְּזֵירָה בִּיאָה רִאשׁוֹנָה, אַטּוּ בִּיאָה שְׁנִיָּה.
human_translation: first intercourse decree due to a second intercourse.
llm_translation: Decree first intercourse, come second intercourse.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: אִם קָדְמוּ וּבָעֲלוּ בִּיאָה רִאשׁוֹנָה – קָנוּ, וְאָסוּר לְקַיְּימָן בְּבִיאָה שְׁנִיָּה.
human_translation: This is also taught If went ahead and engaged in a first intercourse he acquired but it is prohibited to retain for a second intercourse.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: If they engaged in intercourse and consummated the first act - they have acquired, and it is forbidden to fulfill them with a second act.

hebrew_text: מֵת לוֹ מֵת כּוּ׳. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״וּמִן הַמִּקְדָּשׁ לֹא יֵצֵא״ – לֹא יֵצֵא עִמָּהֶן, אֲבָל יוֹצֵא הוּא אַחֲרֵיהֶן. כֵּיצַד? הֵן נִכְסִין וְהוּא נִגְלֶה, הֵן נִיגְלִין וְהוּא נִכְסֶה.
human_translation: of his died, The Sages taught “And from the Temple he shall not emerge” He shall not emerge with them but he emerges after them. How so? they are concealed he is revealed they are revealed, he is concealed.
llm_translation: Deceased to him deceased as well. The Rabbis taught: "And from the sanctuary he shall not go out" - he shall not go out with them, but he may go out after them. How so? They are concealed and he is revealed, they are revealed and he is concealed.

hebrew_text: וְיוֹצֵא עַד פֶּתַח כּוּ׳. שַׁפִּיר קָאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: emerges with them until the entrance Rabbi Yehuda is saying well,
llm_translation: "And he goes out until the entrance of the courtyard." Rabbi Yehuda said well.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָךְ רַבִּי מֵאִיר: אִי הָכִי, לְבֵיתוֹ נָמֵי לָא! אֶלָּא הָכִי קָאָמַר: ״מִן הַמִּקְדָּשׁ לֹא יֵצֵא״ – מִקְּדוּשָּׁתוֹ לֹא יֵצֵא. וְכֵיוָן דְּאִית לֵיהּ הֶכֵּירָא, לָא אָתֵי לְמִינְגַּע.
human_translation: Rabbi Meir said to you: If so, not to his house as well Rather, this it is saying: “And from the Temple [ hamikdash ] he shall not emerge” From his sanctity [ mikedushato ] he shall not emerge and since he has a distinctive indicator he will not come to touch
llm_translation: He said to you, Rabbi Meir: If so, to his house he does not go! Rather, thus he said: "He shall not go out from the sanctuary" - from his sanctity he shall not go out. And since he has recognition, he does not come to touch.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה: אַגַּב מְרָרֵיהּ, דִּילְמָא מִקְּרֵי וְאָתֵי וְנָגַע.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda on account of his bitterness perhaps it will happen that he comes and touches
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda: Because of its bitterness, perhaps one may read and come to touch.

hebrew_text: כְּשֶׁהוּא מְנַחֵם. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: כְּשֶׁהוּא עוֹבֵר בַּשּׁוּרָה לְנַחֵם אֶת אֲחֵרִים – סְגָן וּמָשׁוּחַ שֶׁעָבַר בִּימִינוֹ, וְרֹאשׁ בֵּית אָב וַאֲבֵלִים וְכׇל הָעָם מִשְּׂמֹאלוֹ. וּכְשֶׁהוּא עוֹמֵד בַּשּׁוּרָה וּמִתְנַחֵם מֵאֲחֵרִים – סְגָן מִימִינוֹ, וְרֹאשׁ בֵּית אָב וְכׇל הָעָם מִשְּׂמֹאלוֹ.
human_translation: when he consoles The Sages taught When passes by in the line to console others, the deputy and former anointed on his right. And the head of the patrilineal family and the mourners; and all the people on his left. And when he is standing in the line and is consoled by others, the deputy on his right, and the head of the patrilineal family and all the people on his left.
llm_translation: When he is comforting. The Rabbis taught: When he is passing in the row to comfort others - the deputy and the anointed priest who passed on his right, and the head of the household and mourners and all the people on his left. And when he is standing in the row and being comforted by others - the deputy on his right, and the head of the household and all the people on his left.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל מָשׁוּחַ שֶׁעָבַר לָא אָתֵי גַּבֵּיהּ. מַאי טַעְמָא? חָלְשָׁא דַּעְתֵּיהּ. סָבַר: קָא חָדֵי בִּי. אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ מֵהָא מַתְנִיתָא תְּלָת. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: הַיְינוּ סְגַן הַיְינוּ מְמוּנֶּה, וּשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: אֲבֵלִים עוֹמְדִין וְכׇל הָעָם עוֹבְרִין, וּשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: אֲבֵלִים לִשְׂמֹאל הַמְנַחֲמִין הֵן עוֹמְדִין.
human_translation: But previously anointed one does not come before him. What is the reason? will become distraught. He will think: He is happy about me Rav Pappa said: Learn from it, from this baraita , three Learn from it the deputy is appointed And learn from it the mourners stand and all the people pass by And learn from it mourners stand to the left of the consolers.
llm_translation: But an anointed one who passed by, does not come back. What is the reason? Because his mind is weak. He thought: it is enough for me. Rav Papa said: Learn from this Mishnah three things. Learn from it: whether appointed or not appointed, and learn from it: mourners stand while all the people pass by, and learn from it: mourners stand to the left, comforters stand to the right.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: בָּרִאשׁוֹנָה הָיוּ אֲבֵלִים עוֹמְדִין, וְכׇל הָעָם עוֹבְרִין. וְהָיוּ שְׁתֵּי מִשְׁפָּחוֹת בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם מִתְגָּרוֹת זוֹ בָּזוֹ, זֹאת אוֹמֶרֶת: ״אֲנִי עוֹבֶרֶת תְּחִלָּה״, וְזֹאת אוֹמֶרֶת: ״אֲנִי עוֹבֶרֶת תְּחִלָּה״. הִתְקִינוּ שֶׁיְּהֵא הָעָם עוֹמְדִין וַאֲבֵלִים עוֹבְרִין.
human_translation: The Sages taught Initially the mourners would stand, and all the people would pass by And there were two families in Jerusalem who would fight with each other, this would say: We pass by first and that would say: We pass by first. they decreed that the people should stand and mourners pass by,
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: Initially, the mourners would stand, and all the people would pass by. And there were two families in Jerusalem who were quarreling with one another, this one saying, "I will pass first," and that one saying, "I will pass first." They established that the people should stand and the mourners should pass.

hebrew_text: (חָזַר, וְהָלַךְ, וְסִיפֵּר. סִימָן).
human_translation: a mnemonic Returned; and walk; and converse.
llm_translation: He saw, and he went, and he told. A sign.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָמֵי בַּר אַבָּא: הֶחְזִיר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אֶת הַדָּבָר לְיוֹשְׁנוֹ בְּצִיפּוֹרִי, שֶׁיִּהְיוּ אֲבֵלִים עוֹמְדִין וְכׇל הָעָם עוֹבְרִין. וְאָמַר רָמֵי בַּר אַבָּא: הִתְקִין רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּצִיפּוֹרִי שֶׁלֹּא תְּהֵא אִשָּׁה מְהַלֶּכֶת בַּשּׁוּק וּבְנָהּ אַחֲרֶיהָ, מִשּׁוּם מַעֲשֶׂה שֶׁהָיָה. וְאָמַר רָמֵי בַּר אַבָּא: הִתְקִין רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּצִיפּוֹרִי שֶׁיִּהְיוּ נָשִׁים מְסַפְּרוֹת בְּבֵית הַכִּסֵּא, מִשּׁוּם יִיחוּד.
human_translation: Rami bar Abba says: Rabbi Yosei returned the matter to its former in Tzippori that the mourners would stand and all the people would pass. And Rami bar Abba says: Rabbi Yosei instituted in Tzippori that a woman should not walk in the market and her son behind her; because of an incident that happened And Rami bar Abba says: Rabbi Yosei instituted in Tzippori that women should converse in the bathroom, because of secluded
llm_translation: Ramei bar Abba said: Rabbi Yosei returned the matter to its original state in Tzipori, so that mourners would be standing and all the people passing by. And Ramei bar Abba said: Rabbi Yosei established in Tzipori that a woman should not walk in the marketplace with her son following her, because of an incident that occurred. And Ramei bar Abba said: Rabbi Yosei established in Tzipori that women should count in the bathroom, because of modesty.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב מְנַשְּׁיָא בַּר עוּת: שְׁאֵילִית אֶת רַבִּי יֹאשִׁיָּה רַבָּה בְּבֵית עָלְמִין דְּהוּצָל, וְאָמַר לִי: אֵין שׁוּרָה פְּחוּתָה מֵעֲשָׂרָה בְּנֵי אָדָם, וְאֵין אֲבֵלִים מִן הַמִּנְיָן. בֵּין שֶׁאֲבֵלִים עוֹמְדִין וְכׇל הָעָם עוֹבְרִין, בֵּין שֶׁאֲבֵלִים עוֹבְרִין וְכׇל הָעָם עוֹמְדִין.
human_translation: Rav Menashya bar Ute says: I asked Rabbi Yoshiya the Great in the cemetery of Huzal, and he said to me: There is no line fewer than ten people, and mourners are not count. whether the mourners stand and all the people pass by, or the mourners pass by and all the people stand.
llm_translation: Rav Menashya bar Uta said: I asked Rabbi Yoshiyah Rabbah in the cemetery of Hutzal, and he said to me: There is no less than ten people in a row, and mourners are not counted in the minyan. Whether the mourners are standing and all the people are passing, or the mourners are passing and all the people are standing.

hebrew_text: כְּשֶׁהוּא מִתְנַחֵם כּוּ׳. אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: כִּי מְנַחֵם הוּא אַחֲרִינֵי, הֵיכִי אָמַר לְהוּ? תָּא שְׁמַע: וְהוּא אוֹמֵר תִּתְנַחֲמוּ. הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִילֵּימָא כִּי מְנַחֲמִי אַחֲרִינֵי לְדִידֵיהּ, אָמַר לְהוּ אִיהוּ תִּתְנַחֲמוּ? נְחָשָׁא קָא רָמֵי לְהוּ! אֶלָּא, כִּי מְנַחֵם לְאַחֲרִינֵי אֲמַר לְהוּ תִּתְנַחֲמוּ. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: when he is consoled A dilemma was raised before When consoles others, what he say to them? Come hear And he says: May you be consoled. What are the circumstances If we say that when others console him he says to them: May you be consoled, he throwing a curse at them Rather, When he consoles others, he says to them: May you be consoled. Learn from
llm_translation: When he is comforting them. The Gemara asks: When he is comforting others, how does he say to them? Come and hear: And he says, "Console yourselves." How is this similar? If you say that when he is comforting others on his own behalf, he says to them, "You console yourselves?" A serpent is rising against them! Rather, when he is comforting others, he says to them, "Console yourselves." Learn from this.

hebrew_text: מֶלֶךְ לֹא דָּן כּוּ׳. אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא מַלְכֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל, אֲבָל מַלְכֵי בֵּית דָּוִד דָּן וְדָנִין אוֹתָן, דִּכְתִיב: ״בֵּית דָּוִד כֹּה אָמַר ה׳ דִּינוּ לַבֹּקֶר מִשְׁפָּט״. וְאִי לָא דָּיְינִינַן לֵיהּ, אִינְהוּ הֵיכִי דָּיְינִי? וְהָכְתִיב: ״הִתְקוֹשְׁשׁוּ וָקוֹשּׁוּ״, וְאָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: קְשֹׁט עַצְמְךָ וְאַחַר כָּךְ קְשֹׁט אֲחֵרִים.
human_translation: A king does not judge Rav Yosef says: They taught only the kings of Israel, but the kings of the house of David, judges and is judged, as it is written: “O house of David, so says the Lord: Execute justice in the morning” If they do not judge him, how can he judge? But isn’t it written: “Gather yourselves together, yea, gather together [ hitkosheshu vakoshu ]” and Reish Lakish says: Adorn [ kashet ] yourself and then adorn others,
llm_translation: King does not judge. Rav Yosef said: They only taught this regarding the kings of Israel, but the kings of the house of David do judge and are judged, as it is written: "O house of David, thus says the Lord: Execute justice in the morning." And if we do not judge him, how will they judge? And it is written: "Gird yourselves and be girded," and Reish Lakish said: Adorn yourself first, and then adorn others.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מַלְכֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל מַאי טַעְמָא לָא? מִשּׁוּם מַעֲשֶׂה שֶׁהָיָה, דְּעַבְדֵּיהּ דְּיַנַּאי מַלְכָּא קְטַל נַפְשָׁא. אֲמַר לְהוּ שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן שָׁטַח לַחֲכָמִים: תְּנוּ עֵינֵיכֶם בּוֹ וּנְדוּנֶנּוּ. שְׁלַחוּ לֵיהּ: עַבְדָּךְ קְטַל נַפְשָׁא. שַׁדְּרֵיהּ לְהוּ. שְׁלַחוּ לֵיהּ: תָּא אַנְתְּ נָמֵי לְהָכָא, ״וְהוּעַד בִּבְעָלָיו״ אָמְרָה תּוֹרָה – יָבֹא בַּעַל הַשּׁוֹר וְיַעֲמוֹד עַל שׁוֹרוֹ.
human_translation: But what is the reason do not the kings of Israel? because of an incident that happened, as the slave of Yannai the king killed a person. Shimon ben Shataḥ said to the Sages: Put your eyes on him and let us judge him. They sent to Your slave killed a person. sent to them. They sent to You also come here, “He should be testified against with his owner” The Torah stated: The owner of the ox should come and stand over his ox.
llm_translation: Rather, what is the reason that the kings of Israel do not participate in the trial of the red heifer? Because of an incident that occurred, for the servants of King Yanai killed a person. Shimon ben Shatach said to the sages: "Examine him thoroughly." They sent to him the servant, "Your servant killed a person." They sent him away. They sent to him Shimon ben Shatach: "You too come here," as the Torah states: "The owner of the ox shall stand with his ox."

hebrew_text: אֲתָא וִיתֵיב. אֲמַר לֵיהּ שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן שָׁטַח: יַנַּאי הַמֶּלֶךְ, עֲמוֹד עַל רַגְלֶיךָ וְיָעִידוּ בָּךְ. וְלֹא לְפָנֵינוּ אַתָּה עוֹמֵד, אֶלָּא לִפְנֵי מִי שֶׁאָמַר וְהָיָה הָעוֹלָם אַתָּה עוֹמֵד, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְעָמְדוּ שְׁנֵי הָאֲנָשִׁים אֲשֶׁר לָהֶם הָרִיב וְגוֹ״. אָמַר לוֹ: לֹא כְּשֶׁתֹּאמַר אַתָּה, אֶלָּא כְּמָה שֶׁיֹּאמְרוּ חֲבֵרֶיךָ.
human_translation: came and sat down. Shimon ben Shataḥ said to him: Yannai the king, stand on your feet and will testify against you. And not before us you are standing, but before the One Who spoke and the world came into being you are standing, as it is stated: “Then both the people, between whom the controversy is, shall stand said to him: not when you say but according to what your colleagues say,
llm_translation: He came and sat. Shimon ben Shatach said to him: Yannai the king, stand on your feet and let them testify against you. And not before us are you standing, but before the One who said and the world came into being, you are standing, as it is stated: "And the two men who have the dispute shall stand." He said to him: Not as you say, but as your companions will say.

hebrew_text: נִפְנָה לִימִינוֹ – כָּבְשׁוּ פְּנֵיהֶם בַּקַּרְקַע. נִפְנָה לִשְׂמֹאלוֹ – וְכָבְשׁוּ פְּנֵיהֶם בַּקַּרְקַע. אָמַר לָהֶן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן שָׁטַח: בַּעֲלֵי מַחְשָׁבוֹת אַתֶּם, יָבֹא בַּעַל מַחְשָׁבוֹת וְיִפָּרַע מִכֶּם! מִיָּד בָּא גַּבְרִיאֵל וַחֲבָטָן בַּקַּרְקַע, וּמֵתוּ. בְּאוֹתָהּ שָׁעָה אָמְרוּ: מֶלֶךְ לֹא דָּן וְלֹא דָּנִין אוֹתוֹ, לֹא מֵעִיד וְלֹא מְעִידִין אוֹתוֹ.
human_translation: turned to his right. forced their faces to the ground He turned to his left, and they forced their faces to the ground Shimon ben Shataḥ said to them: You are masters of thoughts, May the Master of thoughts, come and punish you. Immediately, Gabriel came and struck to the ground, and they died. At that moment, said: A king does not judge and do not judge him, he does not testify and do not testify concerning him,
llm_translation: He turned to their right - they fell on their faces to the ground. He turned to their left - and they fell on their faces to the ground. Shimon ben Shatach said to them: "You are masters of deceitful thoughts, let the master of deceitful thoughts come and exact payment from you!" Immediately Gabriel came and struck them to the ground, and they died. At that moment they said: "A king does not judge and is not judged, does not testify and is not testified against."

hebrew_text: לֹא חוֹלֵץ וְלֹא חוֹלְצִין וְכוּ׳. אִינִי? וְהָאָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: אֲפִילּוּ לְמַאן דְּאָמַר נָשִׂיא שֶׁמָּחַל עַל כְּבוֹדוֹ – כְּבוֹדוֹ מָחוּל, מֶלֶךְ שֶׁמָּחַל עַל כְּבוֹדוֹ – אֵין כְּבוֹדוֹ מָחוּל, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״שׂוֹם תָּשִׂים עָלֶיךָ מֶלֶךְ״, שֶׁתְּהֵא אֵימָתוֹ עָלֶיךָ! מִצְוָה שָׁאנֵי.
human_translation: does not perform ḥalitza and does not perform ḥalitza Is that so? But doesn’t Rav Ashi say: Even according to the one who says a Nasi who relinquished honor him, his honor is relinquished, a king who relinquished honor him, his honor is not relinquished, as it is stated: “You shall set a king over you” that his fear should be upon you. A mitzva is different;
llm_translation: Not one may divorce, and not one may be divorced, etc. Is it not so? But didn't Rav Ashi say: Even according to the one who says a prince may waive his honor - his honor is waived, a king who waives his honor - his honor is not waived, as it is stated: "You shall surely set a king over you," that his fear should be upon you! The commandment is different.

hebrew_text: וְאֵין נוֹשְׂאִין כּוּ׳. תַּנְיָא, אָמְרוּ לוֹ לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה: נָשִׁים הָרְאוּיוֹת לוֹ מִבֵּית הַמֶּלֶךְ. וּמַאי נִינְהוּ? מֵירַב וּמִיכַל.
human_translation: And no one may marry It is taught said to Rabbi Yehuda: women appropriate for him from the house of the king. And who are they? Merab and Michal,
llm_translation: "And we do not raise objections. It was taught: They said to Rabbi Yehuda: Women who are fitting for him from the house of the king. And who are they? Merav and Michal."

hebrew_text: שָׁאֲלוּ תַּלְמִידָיו אֶת רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: הֵיאַךְ נָשָׂא דָּוִד שְׁתֵּי אֲחָיוֹת בְּחַיֵּיהֶן? אָמַר לָהֶן: מִיכַל אַחַר מִיתַת מֵירַב נְשָׂאָהּ. רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן קׇרְחָה אוֹמֵר: קִידּוּשֵׁי טָעוּת הָיוּ לוֹ בְּמֵירַב, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״תְּנָה אֶת אִשְׁתִּי אֶת מִיכַל אֲשֶׁר אֵרַסְתִּי לִי בְּמֵאָה עׇרְלוֹת פְּלִשְׁתִּים״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei’s students asked him: How did David marry two sisters while they were alive? said to them: He married Michal after the death of Merab, Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korḥa says His betrothal to Merab was in error as it is stated “Deliver me my wife Michal, whom I betrothed to me for one hundred foreskins of the Philistines”
llm_translation: The disciples asked Rabbi Yosei: How did David marry two sisters in their lifetime? He said to them: Michal after the death of Merav he married her. Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korcha says: He had errors in his sanctifications with Merav, as it is said: "Give me my wife Michal, whom I betrothed to me with a hundred Philistine foreskins."

hebrew_text: מַאי תַּלְמוּדָא? אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: ״מִיכַל אִשְׁתִּי״, וְלֹא מֵירַב אִשְׁתִּי.
human_translation: What the derivation Rav Pappa says: Michal my wife but Merab not my wife.
llm_translation: What is the Talmud? Rav Papa said: "Michal the daughter of Saul," and not "the wife of my father."

hebrew_text: מַאי קִידּוּשֵׁי טָעוּת? דִּכְתִיב: ״וְהָיָה הָאִישׁ אֲשֶׁר יַכֶּנּוּ יַעְשְׁרֶנּוּ הַמֶּלֶךְ עֹשֶׁר גָּדוֹל וְגוֹ׳״. אֲזַל קַטְלֵיהּ. אָמַר לוֹ: מִלְוָה אִית לָךְ גַּבַּאי, וְהַמְקַדֵּשׁ בְּמִלְוֶה אֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת.
human_translation: What a mistaken betrothal? As it is written “And it shall be that the man who kills him, the king will enrich him with great riches went killed said to him: You have a loan my And one who betroths by a loan, she is not betrothed,
llm_translation: What are the sanctifications of error? As it is written: "And the man whom the king delights to honor, let the king's wealth be given to him" (Esther 6:7). He went and killed him. He said to him: Do you have a guarantor? And one who sanctifies with a loan does not sanctify.

hebrew_text: אֲזַל יַהֲבַהּ לְעַדְרִיאֵל, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיְהִי בְּעֵת תֵּת אֶת מֵירַב בַּת שָׁאוּל לְדָוִד וְגוֹ׳״. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִי בָּעֵית דְּאֶתֵּן לָךְ מִיכַל, זִיל אַיְיתִי לִי מֵאָה עׇרְלוֹת פְּלִשְׁתִּים. אֲזַל אַיְיתִי לֵיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִלְוָה וּפְרוּטָה אִית לָךְ גַּבַּאי.
human_translation: went gave to Adriel, as it is written: “But it came to pass at the time when Merab, Saul’s daughter, should have been given to David, said to If you want me to give you Michal, go bring me one hundred foreskins of the Philistines went brought said to him: you, have a loan and peruta my
llm_translation: He went and gave it to Adriel, as it is written: "And it came to pass at the time when Merab, Saul's daughter, should have been given to David, etc." He said to him: If you want me to give you Michal, bring me a hundred Philistine foreskins. He went and brought them to him. He said to him: You have a loan and interest.

hebrew_text: שָׁאוּל סְבַר: מִלְוָה וּפְרוּטָה – דַּעְתֵּיהּ אַמִּלְוָה, וְדָוִד סְבַר: מִלְוָה וּפְרוּטָה – דַּעְתֵּיהּ אַפְּרוּטָה.
human_translation: Saul reasoned by a loan and peruta , his mind on the loan And David reasoned by a loan and peruta , his mind on the peruta
llm_translation: Saul thought: "Milveh and Prutah - his opinion is Milveh." And David thought: "Milveh and Prutah - his opinion is also Prutah."

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא מִלְוָה וּפְרוּטָה – דַּעְתֵּיהּ אַפְּרוּטָה. שָׁאוּל סְבַר: לָא חֲזוּ וְלָא מִידֵּי, וְדָוִד סְבַר: חֲזוֹ לְכַלְבֵי וְשׁוּנָּרֵי.
human_translation: And if you wish, say Everyone by a loan and peruta , his mind on the peruta . Saul reasoned are not fit for any And David reasoned they are fit for dogs and cats
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: The entire world is a guarantor, and the detail - his mind is detailed. Shaul thought: Not seen and not from him, and David thought: Seen for dogs and swine.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי, הַאי ״תְּנָה אֶת אִשְׁתִּי אֶת מִיכַל״ מַאי דָּרֵישׁ בֵּיהּ? רַבִּי יוֹסֵי לְטַעְמֵיהּ, דְּתַנְיָא: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הָיָה דּוֹרֵשׁ מִקְרָאוֹת מְעוֹרָבִין.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yosei, this “Deliver me my wife Michal” what derive from it? Rabbi Yosei to his reasoning, as it is taught Rabbi Yosei would derive mixed verses
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei, this "Give my wife Michal" what does he expound in it? Rabbi Yosei according to his reasoning, as it was taught: Rabbi Yosei would expound mixed verses.

hebrew_text: כְּתִיב: ״וַיִּקַּח הַמֶּלֶךְ אֶת שְׁנֵי בְּנֵי רִצְפָּה בַת אַיָּה אֲשֶׁר יָלְדָה לְשָׁאוּל אֶת אַרְמֹנִי וְאֶת מְפִיבֹשֶׁת וְאֶת חֲמֵשֶׁת בְּנֵי מִיכַל אֲשֶׁר יָלְדָה לְעַדְרִיאֵל הַמְּחֹלָתִי וְגוֹ׳״. וְכִי לְעַדְרִיאֵל נִתְּנָה? וַהֲלֹא לְפַלְטִי בֶּן לַיִשׁ נִתְּנָה! דִּכְתִיב: ״וְשָׁאוּל נָתַן אֶת מִיכַל בִּתּוֹ אֵשֶׁת דָּוִד לְפַלְטִי בֶן לַיִשׁ וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: It is written: “But the king took the two sons of Rizpah, daughter of Aiah, whom she bore unto Saul, Armoni and Mephibosheth, and the five sons of Michal, whom she bore to Adriel, the Meholathite” But did give to Adriel? But didn’t he give her to Palti, son of Laish, as it is written: “Now Saul had given Michal his daughter, David’s wife, to Palti, son of Laish”
llm_translation: It is written: "And the king took the two sons of Rizpah the daughter of Aiah, whom she bore to Saul, Armoni and Mephibosheth, and the five sons of Michal the daughter of Saul, whom she bore to Adriel the Meholathite, etc." And was she given to Adriel? Was she not given to Palti son of Laish! As it is written: "And Saul gave Michal his daughter, David's wife, to Palti son of Laish, etc."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מַקִּישׁ קִידּוּשֵׁי מֵירַב לְעַדְרִיאֵל לְקִידּוּשֵׁי מִיכַל לְפַלְטִי: מָה קִידּוּשֵׁי מִיכַל לְפַלְטִי – בַּעֲבֵירָה, אַף קִידּוּשֵׁי מֵירַב לְעַדְרִיאֵל – בַּעֲבֵירָה.
human_translation: Rather, compares Merab’s betrothal to Adriel to Michal’s betrothal to Palti: Just as Michal’s betrothal to Palti in transgression, so, too, Merab’s betrothal to Adriel in transgression,
llm_translation: Rather, it juxtaposes the betrothals of Meirav to Adriel with the betrothals of Michal to Palti: Just as the betrothals of Michal to Palti - through transgression, so too the betrothals of Meirav to Adriel - through transgression.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן קׇרְחָה נָמֵי, הָכְתִיב: ״אֶת חֲמֵשֶׁת בְּנֵי מִיכַל בַּת שָׁאוּל״? אָמַר לְךָ רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: וְכִי מִיכַל יָלְדָה? וַהֲלֹא מֵירַב יָלְדָה! מֵירַב יָלְדָה וּמִיכַל גִּידְּלָה, לְפִיכָךְ נִקְרְאוּ עַל שְׁמָהּ. לְלַמֶּדְךָ שֶׁכׇּל הַמְגַדֵּל יָתוֹם בְּתוֹךְ בֵּיתוֹ מַעֲלֶה עָלָיו הַכָּתוּב כְּאִילּוּ יְלָדוֹ.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korḥa as well, isn’t it written: “And the five sons of Michal, daughter of Saul, Rabbi Yehoshua said to you And did Michal give birth But didn’t Merab give birth Merab gave birth and Michal raised Therefore, were called by her name, to teach you that anyone who raises an orphan in his house, the verse ascribes him as if he gave birth to him.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korcha said: It is written, "The five sons of Michal, the daughter of Saul." Rabbi Yehoshua said to you: Did Michal give birth? Was it not Merav who gave birth? Merav gave birth and Michal raised them, therefore they were called after her name. This teaches you that anyone who raises an orphan in his home, the Scripture considers it as if he had begotten him.

hebrew_text: (חֲנִינָא קָרָא יוֹחָנָן וְאִשְׁתּוֹ אֶלְעָזָר וּגְאוּלָּה וּשְׁמוּאֵל בְּלִימּוּדוֹ סִימָן.) רַבִּי חֲנִינָא אוֹמֵר, מֵהָכָא: ״וַתִּקְרֶאנָה לוֹ הַשְּׁכֵנוֹת שֵׁם לֵאמֹר יוּלַּד בֵּן לְנׇעֳמִי״. וְכִי נָעֳמִי יָלְדָה? וַהֲלֹא רוּת יָלְדָה! אֶלָּא רוּת יָלְדָה וְנׇעֳמִי גִּידְּלָה, לְפִיכָךְ נִקְרָא עַל שְׁמָהּ.
human_translation: a mnemonic Ḥanina called; Yoḥanan and his wife; Elazar and redemption; and Shmuel in my studies. Rabbi Ḥanina says: from here: “And the neighbors gave him a name, saying: There is a son born to Naomi” And did Naomi give birth But didn’t Ruth give birth Rather, Ruth gave birth and Naomi raised Therefore, he was called by her name:
llm_translation: (Chanina called Yochanan, and his wife Elazar, and Ge'ulah, and Shmuel in his study as a sign.) Rabbi Chanina says, from here: "And the neighbors gave him a name, saying, 'A son is born to Naomi.'" But did Naomi give birth? Was it not Ruth who gave birth? Rather, Ruth gave birth and Naomi raised him, therefore he was called after her name.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר, מֵהָכָא: ״וְאִשְׁתּוֹ הַיְהֻדִיָּה יָלְדָה אֶת יֶרֶד אֲבִי גְדוֹר וְגוֹ׳ וְאֵלֶּה בְּנֵי בִּתְיָה בַת פַּרְעֹה אֲשֶׁר לָקַח (לוֹ) מָרֶד״. מָרֶד זֶה כָּלֵב, וְלָמָּה נִקְרָא שְׁמוֹ מֶרֶד? שֶׁמָּרַד בַּעֲצַת מְרַגְּלִים. וְכִי בִּתְיָה יָלְדָה? וַהֲלֹא יוֹכֶבֶד יָלְדָה! אֶלָּא יוֹכֶבֶד יָלְדָה וּבִתְיָה גִּידְּלָה, לְפִיכָךְ נִקְרָא עַל שְׁמָהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: from here: “And his wife Hajehudijah gave birth to Jered the father of Gedor, and these are the sons of Bithiah, daughter of Pharaoh, whom Mered took” Mered is Caleb, and why was his name called Mered? Because he rebelled [ marad ] against the counsel of the spies. And did Bithiah give birth But didn’t Jochebed give birth Rather, Jochebed gave birth and Bithiah raised Therefore, he was called by her name
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said, from here: "And his Jewish wife bore Yered the father of Gedor, etc., and these are the sons of Bityah the daughter of Pharaoh whom he took (for himself) as a wife." Yered is Caleb, and why was his name called Mered? Because he rebelled against the advice of the spies. Did Bityah actually give birth? Wasn't it Yocheved who gave birth? Rather, Yocheved gave birth and Bityah raised him, therefore he was called after her name.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אָמַר, מֵהָכָא: ״גָּאַלְתָּ בִּזְרוֹעַ עַמֶּךָ בְּנֵי יַעֲקֹב וְיוֹסֵף סֶלָה״. וְכִי יוֹסֵף יָלַד? וַהֲלֹא יַעֲקֹב יָלַד! אֶלָּא, יַעֲקֹב יָלַד וְיוֹסֵף כִּילְכֵּל, לְפִיכָךְ נִקְרְאוּ עַל שְׁמוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar says: from here: “You have with Your arm redeemed your people, the children of Jacob and Joseph, Selah” And did Joseph sire But didn’t Jacob sire them? Rather, Jacob sired and Joseph sustained Therefore, they were called by his name;
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said, from here: "You have redeemed with Your arm Your people, the sons of Jacob and Joseph, Selah." But did Joseph give birth? Didn't Jacob give birth! Rather, Jacob gave birth and Joseph was considered as if he gave birth, therefore they were called by his name.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן: כׇּל הַמְלַמֵּד בֶּן חֲבֵירוֹ תּוֹרָה, מַעֲלֶה עָלָיו הַכָּתוּב כְּאִילּוּ יְלָדוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְאֵלֶּה תּוֹלְדֹת אַהֲרֹן וּמֹשֶׁה״, וּכְתִיב: ״וְאֵלֶּה שְׁמוֹת בְּנֵי אַהֲרֹן״. לוֹמַר לָךְ: אַהֲרֹן יָלַד וּמֹשֶׁה לִימֵּד, לְפִיכָךְ נִקְרְאוּ עַל שְׁמוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani says Rabbi Yonatan says: Anyone who teaches another son Torah, the verse ascribes him as if he sired him, as it is stated: “Now these are the generations of Aaron and Moses” and it is written “And these are the names of the sons of Aaron: to say to you Aaron sired but Moses taught Therefore, were called by his name.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said Rabbi Yonatan: Anyone who teaches his fellow's son Torah, the Scripture considers it as if he gave birth to him, as it is stated: "These are the generations of Aharon and Moshe," and it is written: "These are the names of the sons of Aharon." To tell you: Aharon gave birth and Moshe taught, therefore they were called by his name.

hebrew_text: ״לָכֵן כֹּה אָמַר ה׳ אֶל בֵּית יַעֲקֹב אֲשֶׁר פָּדָה אֶת אַבְרָהָם״, וְכִי הֵיכָן מָצִינוּ בְּיַעֲקֹב שֶׁפְּדָאוֹ לְאַבְרָהָם? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: שֶׁפְּדָאוֹ מִצַּעַר גִּידּוּל בָּנִים. וְהַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב: ״לֹא עַתָּה יֵבוֹשׁ יַעֲקֹב וְגוֹ׳״, ״לֹא עַתָּה יֵבוֹשׁ יַעֲקֹב״ – מֵאָבִיו, ״וְלֹא עַתָּה פָּנָיו יֶחֱוָרוּ״ – מֵאֲבִי אָבִיו.
human_translation: “Therefore, so says the Lord to the house of Jacob, who redeemed Abraham; But where have we found about Jacob that he redeemed Abraham? Rav Yehuda says: that he redeemed him from the suffering of raising children, And this is as it is written: “Jacob shall not now be ashamed, “Jacob shall not now be ashamed” before his father, “neither shall his face now wax pale” before his father’s father,
llm_translation: "Thus said Hashem to the house of Jacob, who redeemed Abraham," And where do we find in Jacob that he redeemed Abraham? Rav Yehudah said: He redeemed him from the distress of raising children. And this is what is written: "Now shall Jacob not be ashamed, etc.," "Now shall Jacob not be ashamed" – from his father, "and now shall his face not be pale" – from his father's father.

hebrew_text: כְּתִיב ״פַּלְטִי״ וּכְתִיב ״פַּלְטִיאֵל״. אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: פַּלְטִי שְׁמוֹ, וְלָמָּה נִקְרָא שְׁמוֹ פַּלְטִיאֵל? שֶׁפִּלְּטוֹ אֵל מִן הָעֲבֵירָה. מָה עָשָׂה? נָעַץ חֶרֶב בֵּינוֹ לְבֵינָהּ. אָמַר: כׇּל הָעוֹסֵק בְּדָבָר זֶה יִדָּקֵר בֶּחָרֶב (זֶה).
human_translation: It is written “Palti” and it is written “Paltiel” Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Palti his name, and why was his name called Paltiel? that God [ El ] saved [ pelato ] him from the sin, What did he do? He embedded a sword between him and her, said: Anyone who engages in this matter, should be stabbed by this sword.
llm_translation: It is written "Palti" and it is written "Paltiel." Rabbi Yochanan said: His name is Palti, so why was he called Paltiel? Because he saved her from sin. What did he do? He inserted a sword between them. He said: Anyone who engages in this matter will be pierced by a sword (this).

hebrew_text: וְהָכְתִיב: ״וַיֵּלֶךְ אִתָּהּ אִישָׁהּ״? שֶׁנַּעֲשָׂה לָהּ כְּאִישָׁהּ. וְהָכְתִיב: ״הָלוֹךְ וּבָכֹה״? עַל מִצְוָה דַּאֲזַיל מִינֵּיהּ. ״עַד בַּחֻרִים״, שֶׁנַּעֲשׂוּ שְׁנֵיהֶם כְּבַחוּרִים, שֶׁלֹּא טָעֲמוּ טַעַם בִּיאָה.
human_translation: But isn’t it written: “And her husband went with her, that he became like a husband for her But isn’t it written “weeping as he went”? about the mitzva that left him, “to Bahurim,” that they both became like young men [ baḥurim ] that they did not taste sexual intercourse
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it is written: "And he went with her, her husband"? That she became to her as her husband. And it is written: "Going and weeping"? For the commandment that departs from him. "Until young men," that they both became like young men, that they did not taste the taste of intercourse.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: תּוֹקְפּוֹ שֶׁל יוֹסֵף – עִנְוְותָנוּתוֹ שֶׁל בּוֹעַז, תּוֹקְפּוֹ שֶׁל בּוֹעַז – עִנְוְותָנוּתוֹ שֶׁל פַּלְטִי בֶּן לַיִשׁ. תּוֹקְפּוֹ שֶׁל יוֹסֵף – עִנְוְותָנוּתוֹ שֶׁל בּוֹעַז, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיְהִי בַּחֲצִי הַלַּיְלָה וַיֶּחֱרַד הָאִישׁ וַיִּלָּפֵת״. מַאי ״וַיִּלָּפֵת״? אָמַר רַב: שֶׁנַּעֲשָׂה בְּשָׂרוֹ כְּרָאשֵׁי לְפָתוֹת.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Joseph’s power humility of Boaz, Boaz’s power humility of Palti, son of Laish, Joseph’s power humility of Boaz, as it is written “And it came to pass at midnight that the man was startled and turned himself, What “and turned himself [ vayyilafet ]”? Rav says: that his flesh became like the heads of turnips [ lefatot ],
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: The strength of Joseph - the humility of Boaz, the strength of Boaz - the humility of Ploni ben Ploni. The strength of Joseph - the humility of Boaz, as it is written: "And it was in the middle of the night, and the man trembled and turned." What is "turned"? Rav said: His flesh became like the tops of turnips.

hebrew_text: תּוֹקְפּוֹ שֶׁל בּוֹעַז – עִנְוְותָנוּתוֹ שֶׁל פַּלְטִי בֶּן לַיִשׁ, כְּדַאֲמַרַן.
human_translation: Boaz’s power humility of Palti, son of Laish, as we said,
llm_translation: The strength of Boaz - the humility of Ploni ben Ploni, as we have said.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מַאי דִּכְתִיב ״רַבּוֹת בָּנוֹת עָשׂוּ חָיִל וְאַתְּ עָלִית עַל כֻּלָּנָה״? ״רַבּוֹת בָּנוֹת עָשׂוּ חָיִל״ – זֶה יוֹסֵף וּבוֹעַז. ״וְאַתְּ עָלִית עַל כֻּלָּנָה״ – זֶה פַּלְטִי בֶּן לַיִשׁ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: What which is written: “Many daughters have done valiantly, but you excel above them all” “Many daughters have done valiantly”; this Joseph and Boaz. “But you excel above them all”; this Palti, son of Laish,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: What is the meaning of the verse, "Many daughters have done valiantly, but you excel them all"? "Many daughters have done valiantly" – this refers to Joseph and Boaz. "But you excel them all" – this refers to Palti son of Laish.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָן אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן: מַאי דִּכְתִיב ״שֶׁקֶר הַחֵן וְהֶבֶל הַיֹּפִי״? ״שֶׁקֶר הַחֵן״ – זֶה יוֹסֵף, ״וְהֶבֶל הַיֹּפִי״ – זֶה בּוֹעַז. ״יִרְאַת ה׳ הִיא תִתְהַלָּל״ – זֶה פַּלְטִי בֶּן לַיִשׁ.
human_translation: Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥman says Rabbi Yonatan says: What which is written: “Grace is deceitful, and beauty is vain, “Grace is deceitful”; this Joseph. “And beauty is vain”; this Boaz. “Who fears the Lord, she shall be praised”; this Palti, son of Laish,
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachman said Rabbi Yonatan: What is the meaning of what is written, "Grace is deceitful, and beauty is vain"? "Grace is deceitful" - this is Yosef, "and beauty is vain" - this is Boaz. "The fear of the Lord, she shall be praised" - this is Palti son of Laish.

hebrew_text: דָּבָר אַחֵר: ״שֶׁקֶר הַחֵן״ – זֶה דּוֹרוֹ שֶׁל מֹשֶׁה, ״וְהֶבֶל הַיֹּפִי״ – זֶה דּוֹרוֹ שֶׁל יְהוֹשֻׁעַ, ״יִרְאַת ה׳ הִיא תִתְהַלָּל״ – זֶה דּוֹרוֹ שֶׁל חִזְקִיָּה.
human_translation: Alternatively: “Grace is deceitful”; this the generation of Moses. “And beauty is vain”; this the generation of Joshua. “Who fears the Lord, she shall be praised”; this the generation of Hezekiah.
llm_translation: Another explanation: "False grace" - this is the generation of Moses, "and beauty is vain" - this is the generation of Joshua, "the fear of the Lord, she shall be praised" - this is the generation of Hezekiah.

hebrew_text: דָּבָר אַחֵר: ״שֶׁקֶר הַחֵן״ – זֶה דּוֹרוֹ שֶׁל מֹשֶׁה וִיהוֹשֻׁעַ. ״וְהֶבֶל הַיֹּפִי״ – זֶה דּוֹרוֹ שֶׁל חִזְקִיָּה. ״יִרְאַת ה׳ הִיא תִתְהַלָּל״ – זֶה דּוֹרוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בְּרַבִּי אִילְעַאי. אָמְרוּ עָלָיו עַל רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בְּרַבִּי אִילְעַאי, שֶׁהָיוּ שִׁשָּׁה תַּלְמִידִים מִתְכַּסִּין בְּטַלִּית אַחַת וְעוֹסְקִין בַּתּוֹרָה.
human_translation: Alternatively: “Grace is deceitful”; this the generation of Moses and Joshua. “And beauty is vain”; this the generation of Hezekiah. “Who fears the Lord, she shall be praised”; this the generation of Rabbi Yehuda, son of Rabbi Ilai, It was said about Rabbi Yehuda, son of Rabbi Ilai, that six students would cover themselves with one garment, and engage in Torah
llm_translation: Another explanation: "Sheker haChen" - this is the generation of Moshe and Yehoshua. "Vehevel haYofi" - this is the generation of Chizkiyahu. "Yirat Hashem hi tit'halel" - this is the generation of Rabbi Yehuda bar Ilai. They said about him, about Rabbi Yehuda bar Ilai, that six students would wrap themselves in one cloak and engage in Torah study.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מֵת לוֹ מֵת – אֵינוֹ יוֹצֵא מִפֶּתַח פַּלְטֵרִין שֶׁלּוֹ. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אִם רוֹצֶה לָצֵאת אַחַר הַמִּיטָּה – יוֹצֵא, שֶׁכֵּן מָצִינוּ בְּדָוִד שֶׁיָּצָא אַחַר מִיטָּתוֹ שֶׁל אַבְנֵר, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְהַמֶּלֶךְ דָּוִד הֹלֵךְ אַחַר הַמִּטָּה״. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: לֹא הָיָה הַדָּבָר אֶלָּא לְפַיֵּיס אֶת הָעָם. וּכְשֶׁמַּבְרִין אוֹתוֹ – כׇּל הֶעָם מְסוּבִּין עַל הָאָרֶץ, וְהוּא מֵיסֵב עַל הַדַּרְגֵּשׁ.
human_translation: of dies, he does not emerge from the entrance of his palace [ palterin ], Rabbi Yehuda says: If he wishes to follow the bier, he follows as that is what we found to David, who followed the bier of Abner. As it is stated: “And King David followed the bier” said to The matter was only to appease the people, And when comfort all the people recline on the ground, and he reclines on the dargash .
