Because the Lord has been witness between you and the wife of your youth, against whom you have dealt treacherously, though she is your companion and the wife of your covenant”
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer said: "Anyone who divorces his wife first, even the altar sheds tears for him, as it is stated: 'And this you do as well: You cover the altar of the Lord with tears, weeping and groaning, because He no longer turns His attention to the offering or accepts it favorably from your hand.' And it is written: 'And you say, 'For what reason?' Because the Lord has been witness between you and the wife of your youth, whom you have betrayed, though she is your companion and your covenant wife.'"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: אֵין אִשְׁתּוֹ שֶׁל אָדָם מֵתָה אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן מְבַקְּשִׁין מִמֶּנּוּ מָמוֹן וְאֵין לוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְאִם אֵין לְךָ לְשַׁלֵּם לָמָּה יִקַּח מִשְׁכָּבְךָ מִתַּחְתֶּיךָ״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan, and some say Rabbi Elazar, says: A man’s wife does not die unless ask him for money and he does not have as it is stated: “If you do not have with what to pay, why should he take away your bed from under you?”
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yochanan, and some say Rabbi Elazar: A man's wife does not die unless they seek money from him and he does not have it, as it is stated: "And if you have nothing to pay, why should he take your bed from under you."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כׇּל אָדָם שֶׁמֵּתָה אִשְׁתּוֹ רִאשׁוֹנָה, כְּאִילּוּ חָרַב בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ בְּיָמָיו, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״בֶּן אָדָם הִנְנִי לֹקֵחַ מִמְּךָ אֶת מַחְמַד עֵינֶיךָ בְּמַגֵּפָה לֹא תִסְפֹּד וְלֹא תִבְכֶּה וְלֹא תָבוֹא דִּמְעָתֶךָ״. וּכְתִיב: ״וָאֲדַבֵּר אֶל הָעָם בַּבֹּקֶר וַתָּמׇת אִשְׁתִּי בָּעָרֶב״. וּכְתִיב: ״הִנְנִי מְחַלֵּל אֶת מִקְדָּשִׁי גְּאוֹן עֻזְּכֶם מַחְמַד עֵינֵיכֶם״.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan says: any man whose first wife dies, it is as if the Temple were destroyed in his days, as it is stated: “Son of man, behold, I take away from you the desire of your eyes with a stroke; yet neither shall you make lamentation nor weep, neither shall your tears run down” And it is written: “So I spoke to the people in the morning and in the evening my wife died” And it is written “Behold I will profane My Sanctuary, the pride of your power, the desire of your eyes”
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yochanan said: Any man whose wife dies first, it is as if the Temple was destroyed in his days, as it is stated: "Son of man, behold, I am taking away from you the desire of your eyes with a stroke; yet you shall not mourn or weep, nor shall your tears run down." And it is written: "And I spoke to the people in the morning, and at evening my wife died." And it is written: "Behold, I am profaning My sanctuary, the pride of your strength, the desire of your eyes."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֲלֶכְּסַנְדְּרִי: כׇּל אָדָם שֶׁמֵּתָה אִשְׁתּוֹ בְּיָמָיו, עוֹלָם חָשַׁךְ בַּעֲדוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אוֹר חָשַׁךְ בְּאׇהֳלוֹ וְנֵרוֹ עָלָיו יִדְעָךְ״. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר חֲנִינָא אָמַר: פְּסִיעוֹתָיו מִתְקַצְּרוֹת, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״יֵצְרוּ צַעֲדֵי אוֹנוֹ״. רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ אָמַר: עֲצָתוֹ נוֹפֶלֶת, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְתַשְׁלִיכֵהוּ עֲצָתוֹ״.
human_translation: Rabbi Alexandri says: any man whose wife dies in his days, the world is dark for him, as it is stated: “The light shall be dark in his tent and his lamp over him shall be put out” Rabbi Yosei bar Ḥanina says: His steps get shorter, as it is stated: “The steps of his strength shall be constrained” Rabbi Abbahu says: His counsel falls, as it is stated: “And his own counsel shall cast him down”
llm_translation: Rabbi Alexandri said: Any man whose wife dies in his lifetime, darkness surrounds him, as it is stated: "Light is dark in his tent, and his lamp above him is extinguished." Rabbi Yosei bar Hanina said: His steps are shortened, as it is stated: "They will shorten the steps of his strength." Rabbi Abahu said: His counsel falls, as it is stated: "And his counsel will cast him down."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: קָשֶׁה לְזַוְּוגָם כִּקְרִיעַת יַם סוּף, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אֱלֹהִים מוֹשִׁיב יְחִידִים בַּיְתָה מוֹצִיא אֲסִירִים בַּכּוֹשָׁרוֹת״. אַל תִּיקְרֵי ״מוֹצִיא אֲסִירִים״ אֶלָּא ״כְּמוֹצִיא אֲסִירִים״, אַל תִּיקְרֵי ״בַּכּוֹשָׁרוֹת״ אֶלָּא ״בְּכִי וְשִׁירוֹת״.
human_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: difficult to match as the splitting of the Red Sea, as it is stated: “God makes the solitary dwell in a house; He brings out prisoners into prosperity” Do not read “brings out prisoners”; rather, Like bringing out prisoners. “into prosperity [ bakkosharot ]”; rather, Crying and singing [ bekhi veshirot ],
llm_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: It is as difficult to matchmake them as it is to split the Red Sea, as it is stated: "God settles the solitary in a home, releases prisoners into prosperity." Do not read "releases prisoners" but rather "like one who releases prisoners," do not read "into prosperity" but rather "with weeping and songs."

hebrew_text: אִינִי? וְהָאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: אַרְבָּעִים יוֹם קוֹדֶם יְצִירַת הַוָּלָד, בַּת קוֹל יוֹצֵאת וְאוֹמֶרֶת ״בַּת פְּלוֹנִי לִפְלוֹנִי״! לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא בְּזִוּוּג רִאשׁוֹן, הָא בְּזִוּוּג שֵׁנִי.
human_translation: Is that so But doesn’t Rav Yehuda say Rav says: Forty days before the formation of the fetus a Divine Voice emerges and states: The daughter of so-and-so of so-and-so? not difficult. This is with regard to the first match; that is with regard to the second match.
llm_translation: I am? But didn't Rav Yehudah say in the name of Rav: Forty days before the formation of the fetus, a heavenly voice emerges and proclaims, "The daughter of so-and-so is designated for so-and-so!"? There is no contradiction: one refers to the first pairing, and the other to the second pairing.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָן: לַכֹּל יֵשׁ תְּמוּרָה, חוּץ מֵאֵשֶׁת נְעוּרִים, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְאֵשֶׁת נְעוּרִים כִּי תִמָּאֵס״. מַתְנֵי לַהּ רַב יְהוּדָה לְרַב יִצְחָק בְּרֵיהּ: אֵין אָדָם מוֹצֵא קוֹרַת רוּחַ אֶלָּא מֵאִשְׁתּוֹ רִאשׁוֹנָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״יְהִי מְקוֹרְךָ בָרוּךְ וּשְׂמַח מֵאֵשֶׁת
human_translation: Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥman says: For everything there is a substitute, except for wife from youth as it is stated: “And a wife from youth, can she be rejected?” Rav Yehuda taught Rav Yitzḥak, his son: A man finds calmness of spirit only from his first wife, as it is stated: “Let your fountain be blessed and have joy with the wife of
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachman: For everything there is a substitute, except for the wife of one's youth, as it is stated: "And the wife of your youth, when she is despised." Rav Yehuda taught to Rav Yitzchak his son: A person only finds true satisfaction from his first wife, as it is stated: "Let your fountain be blessed, and rejoice with the wife of your youth."

hebrew_text: נְעוּרֶיךָ״. אָמַר לוֹ: כְּגוֹן מַאן? אָמַר לוֹ: כְּגוֹן אִמָּךְ.
human_translation: your youth” said to him: Such as whom? said to him: Such as your mother.
llm_translation: Your youth." He said to him: "Who is like you?" He said to him: "Like your mother."

hebrew_text: אִינִי? וְהָא מַקְרֵי לֵיהּ רַב יְהוּדָה לְרַב יִצְחָק בְּרֵיהּ: ״וּמוֹצֶא אֲנִי מָר מִמָּוֶת אֶת הָאִשָּׁה אֲשֶׁר הִיא מְצוֹדִים וַחֲרָמִים״. וְאָמַר לוֹ: כְּגוֹן מַאן? וְאָמַר לוֹ: כְּגוֹן אִמָּךְ. מִיתְקָף תַּקִּיפָא, עַיבּוֹרֵי מְעַבְּרָא בְּמִלַּהּ.
human_translation: Is that so? But didn’t Rav Yehuda read to Rav Yitzḥak, his son, “And I find more bitter than death the woman whose is snares and nets” And said to him: Such as whom? And said to him: Such as your mother. she is difficult is conciliatory,
llm_translation: I am? But it is taught: Rav Yehudah called to Rav Yitzchak his son: "And I find more bitter than death the woman who is snares and nets." And he said to him: Who is an example of this? And he said to him: Your mother. A strong argument, crossing over with a word.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר אוּנְיָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב: אִשָּׁה גּוֹלֶם הִיא, וְאֵינָהּ כּוֹרֶתֶת בְּרִית אֶלָּא לְמִי שֶׁעֲשָׂאָהּ כְּלִי, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי בֹעֲלַיִךְ עֹשַׂיִךְ ה׳ צְבָאוֹת שְׁמוֹ״.
human_translation: Rav Shmuel bar Unya says in the name of Rav: A woman is raw material, and makes a covenant, only to the one who made her a vessel as it is stated: “For your Maker is your husband, the Lord of hosts is His name”
llm_translation: Said Rav Shmuel bar Unya in the name of Rav: A woman is a golem, and she does not cut the covenant except for the one who made her a vessel, as it is stated: "For your Maker is your husband, the Lord of Hosts is His name."

hebrew_text: תָּנָא: אֵין אִישׁ מֵת אֶלָּא לְאִשְׁתּוֹ, וְאֵין אִשָּׁה מֵתָה אֶלָּא לְבַעְלָהּ. אֵין אִישׁ מֵת אֶלָּא לְאִשְׁתּוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיָּמָת אֱלִימֶלֶךְ אִישׁ נׇעֳמִי״. וְאֵין אִשָּׁה מֵתָה אֶלָּא לְבַעְלָהּ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַאֲנִי בְּבֹאִי מִפַּדָּן מֵתָה עָלַי רָחֵל״.
human_translation: taught A man dies only to his wife, and a woman dies only to her husband. A man dies only to his wife, as it is stated: “And Elimelech, Naomi’s husband, died” and a woman dies only to her husband, as it is stated “And as for me, when I came from Paddan, Rachel died on me”
llm_translation: Mishnah: A man does not die except for his wife, and a woman does not die except for her husband. A man does not die except for his wife, as it is stated: "And Elimelech, the husband of Naomi, died." And a woman does not die except for her husband, as it is stated: "And as I was coming from Paddan, Rachel died upon me."

hebrew_text: אֵין רוֹאִין אוֹתוֹ כּוּ׳. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מֶלֶךְ מִסְתַּפֵּר בְּכׇל יוֹם, כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל מֵעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת לְעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת, כֹּהֵן הֶדְיוֹט אֶחָד לִשְׁלשִׁים יוֹם.
human_translation: One may not see The Sages taught A king has his hair cut every day. A High Priest from the eve of Shabbat to the eve of Shabbat An ordinary priest once every thirty days.
llm_translation: We do not see him. The Rabbis taught: A king must groom himself every day, the High Priest from one Sabbath eve to the next Sabbath eve, and an ordinary priest once every thirty days.

hebrew_text: מֶלֶךְ מִסְתַּפֵּר בְּכׇל יוֹם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״מֶלֶךְ בְּיׇפְיוֹ תֶּחֱזֶינָה עֵינֶיךָ״. כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל מֵעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת, אָמַר רַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָן אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הוֹאִיל וּמִשְׁמָרוֹת מִתְחַדְּשׁוֹת.
human_translation: A king has his hair cut every day, as it is stated: “Your eyes should see the king in his beauty” A High Priest from the eve of Shabbat Rav Shmuel bar Naḥman says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Since new watches begin
llm_translation: The king grooms himself every day, as it is stated: "The king in his beauty your eyes shall behold." The High Priest from Friday evening, said Rav Shmuel bar Nachman in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: Since the watches are renewed.

hebrew_text: כֹּהֵן הֶדְיוֹט אֶחָד לִשְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְרֹאשָׁם לֹא יְגַלֵּחוּ וּפֶרַע לֹא יְשַׁלֵּחוּ כָּסוֹם יִכְסְמוּ אֶת רָאשֵׁיהֶם״, וְיָלֵיף פֶּרַע פֶּרַע מִנָּזִיר. כְּתִיב הָכָא: ״פֶּרַע לֹא יְשַׁלֵּחוּ״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם: ״גַּדֵּל פֶּרַע שְׂעַר רֹאשׁוֹ״. מָה לְהַלָּן שְׁלֹשִׁים, אַף כָּאן שְׁלֹשִׁים. וּתְנַן נָמֵי: סְתַם נְזִירוּת שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם.
human_translation: An ordinary priest once every thirty days, as it is written “They shall not shave their heads, and long hair they shall not grow out; they shall trim only their heads” and derive “long hair” from “long hair” nazirite. It is written here, “And long hair they shall not grow out,” and it is written there, “Long hair growing on his head” Just as there, thirty so too here, it is thirty And we also learn naziriteship unspecified thirty days.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "A commoner priest, one for thirty days, as it is written: 'They shall not shave their heads, nor let their hair grow long; they shall keep their hair trimmed.' And it is derived that 'let their hair grow long' is separate from a Nazirite. It is written here: 'let their hair grow long,' and it is written there: 'he shall let the locks of the hair of his head grow.' Just as there, it is thirty days, so too here it is thirty days. And we learned in a Mishnah: the default period of Naziriteship is thirty days."

hebrew_text: וְהָתָם מְנָא לַן? אָמַר רַב מַתְנָה: דְּאָמַר קְרָא ״קָדֹשׁ יִהְיֶה״, בְּגִימַטְרִיָּא תְּלָתִין הָווּ.
human_translation: And there, from where do we Rav Mattana says: As the verse states: “He shall be [ yihye ] holy” has the numerical value of thirty.
llm_translation: And there, how do we count? Rav Matna said: As the verse says, "He shall be holy," which in gematria equals thirty.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב פָּפָּא לְאַבָּיֵי: אֵימָא לָא לִירַבּוֹ כְּלָל! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִי כְּתִיב ״לֹא יְשַׁלֵּחוּ פֶּרַע״ – כִּדְקָאָמְרַתְּ, הַשְׁתָּא דִּכְתִיב ״וּפֶרַע [לֹא יְשַׁלֵּחוּ]״ – פֶּרַע לֶיהֱוֵי, שַׁלּוֹחֵי לָא לִשַׁלְּחוּ.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said to Abaye: Say should not grow at all, said to him: Had it been written: They shall not grow long hair, as you said, now that it is written: “And long hair” can be long hair, they should not grow it out
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Papa to Abbaye: Say it not to increase at all! He said to him: If it is written "they shall not send away the hair" - as you said, now that it is written "and the hair they shall not send away" - let it be hair, senders not to send away.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, הָאִידָּנָא נָמֵי? דּוּמְיָא דְּיַיִן: מָה יַיִן, בִּזְמַן בִּיאָה הוּא דְּאָסוּר, שֶׁלֹּא בִּזְמַן בִּיאָה שְׁרֵי – אַף פְּרוּעֵי רֹאשׁ, בִּזְמַן בִּיאָה אָסוּר, שֶׁלֹּא בִּזְמַן בִּיאָה שְׁרֵי.
human_translation: If so, now too, is similar to wine. Just as wine, at time of entering is it forbidden when it is not time of entering permitted, so too, those with long hair, at time of entering prohibited, when not time of entering permitted.
llm_translation: If so, is it now standing? Resembles wine: Just as wine, at the time of its coming is forbidden, but not at the time of its coming is permitted - so too, the priests who are on duty, at the time of their duty are forbidden, but not at the time of their duty are permitted.

hebrew_text: וְיַיִן שֶׁלֹּא בִּזְמַן בִּיאָה שְׁרֵי? וְהָתַנְיָא: רַבִּי אוֹמֵר, אוֹמֵר אֲנִי: כֹּהֲנִים אֲסוּרִין לִשְׁתּוֹת יַיִן לְעוֹלָם, אֲבָל מָה אֶעֱשֶׂה שֶׁתַּקָּנָתוֹ קַלְקָלָתוֹ. וְאָמַר אַבָּיֵי: כְּמַאן שָׁתוּ כָּהֲנֵי חַמְרָא הָאִידָּנָא? כְּרַבִּי. מִכְּלָל דְּרַבָּנַן אָסְרִי.
human_translation: And wine permitted when not time of entering But isn’t it taught Rabbi says: I say always prohibited priests to drink wine, but what can I do, as his repair is his ruin, And Abaye said: In accordance with whose do priests drink wine nowadays? In accordance with Rabbi by inference that the Rabbis prohibit
llm_translation: "And wine that is not at the time of its coming permitted? And it was taught: Rabbi says, I say: The priests are forbidden to drink wine forever, but what shall I do that its acquisition is its ruin. And Abaye said: Like who drank wine, the priests of Hamra now? Like Rabbi. From the principle that the Rabbis forbade."

hebrew_text: הָתָם הַיְינוּ טַעְמָא, מְהֵרָה יִבָּנֶה בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ, וּבָעֵינַן כֹּהֵן הָרָאוּי לָעֲבוֹדָה, וְלֵיכָּא. הָכָא נָמֵי, בָּעֵינָא כֹּהֵן הָרָאוּי לָעֲבוֹדָה, וְלֵיכָּא.
human_translation: There, this is the reason The Temple will speedily be built, and we need a priest who is fit for the service; and there are none. here too, I need a priest who is fit for the service and there are none.
llm_translation: There the same reason, quickly will be built the Temple, and we require a priest fit for service, and there is none. Here also, we require a priest fit for service, and there is none.

hebrew_text: הָכָא אֶפְשָׁר דִּמְסַפַּר וְעָיֵיל. הָתָם נָמֵי אֶפְשָׁר דְּנָיֵים פּוּרְתָּא וְעָיֵיל, דְּאָמַר רַב אַחָא: דֶּרֶךְ מִיל וְשֵׁינָה כׇּל שֶׁהוּא מְפִיגִין אֶת הַיַּיִן. וְלָאו אִיתְּמַר עֲלַהּ: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא שֶׁשָּׁתָה כְּדֵי רְבִיעִית, אֲבָל יוֹתֵר מִכְּדֵי רְבִיעִית – כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן דְּדֶרֶךְ טוֹרַדְתּוֹ וְשֵׁינָה מְשַׁכַּרְתּוֹ.
human_translation: Here it is possible for him to cut his hair and enter There too, it is possible for him to sleep a little and go in, as Rav Aḥa says: the distance of a mil or sleeping a minimal amount dispel the wine But wasn’t it stated with regard to Rav Naḥman says Rabba bar Avuh says: They taught only when he drank a quarter- but more than a quarter- all the more so that distance disturbs him and sleep makes him drunk,
llm_translation: Here it is possible that he counted and brought. There, it is possible that he mixed a little and brought, as Rav Acha said: The way of salt and sleep, everything that causes wine to spoil. And it was not stated about it: Rav Nachman said in the name of Rabba bar Avuh: They only taught concerning one who drank a quarter-log, but more than a quarter-log - all the more so that his way is to mix and sleep intoxicates him.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: שְׁתוּיֵי יַיִן דְּמַחֲלִי עֲבוֹדָה – גְּזַרוּ בְּהוּ רַבָּנַן, פְּרוּעֵי רֹאשׁ דְּלָא מַחֲלִי עֲבוֹדָה – לָא גְּזַרוּ בְּהוּ רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: drunk on wine, who desecrate service the Sages decreed about them long-haired who do not desecrate service the Sages did not decree about them
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: "Two cups of wine that cause a deficiency in service - the Rabbis decreed against them. Loose-headed individuals who do not cause a deficiency in service - the Rabbis did not decree against them."

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: וְאֵלּוּ שֶׁבְּמִיתָה – פְּרוּעֵי רֹאשׁ וּשְׁתוּיֵי יַיִן.
human_translation: raises an objection And these are who are to death with long hair or drunk on wine.
llm_translation: Challenger: And these are the cases of execution - beheading and drinking wine.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא שְׁתוּיֵי יַיִן, דִּכְתִיב: ״יַיִן וְשֵׁכָר אַל תֵּשְׁתְּ אַתָּה וּבָנֶיךָ... וְלֹא תָמֻתוּ״. אֶלָּא פְּרוּעֵי רֹאשׁ, מְנָא לַן?
human_translation: Granted, drunk on wine as it is written: “Drink no wine nor strong drink, you, nor your sons with you, that you not die; But with long hair, from where do we
llm_translation: In truth, the drinking of wine, as it is written: "Wine and strong drink you shall not drink, you and your sons... so that you do not die." Rather, with loosened head-coverings, how do we count?

hebrew_text: דְּאִיתַּקַּשׁ שְׁתוּיֵי יַיִן לִפְרוּעֵי רֹאשׁ, כְּתִיב: ״וְרֹאשָׁם לֹא יְגַלֵּחוּ וּפֶרַע לֹא יְשַׁלֵּחוּ״, וּכְתִיב: ״וְיַיִן לֹא יִשְׁתּוּ וְגוֹ׳״. מָה שְׁתוּיֵי יַיִן בְּמִיתָה, אַף פְּרוּעֵי רֹאשׁ בְּמִיתָה.
human_translation: that drunk on wine were juxtaposed to those with long hair. It is written: “They shall not shave their heads, and long hair they shall not grow out” and it is written “Neither shall any priest drink wine Just as drunk on wine to death so too, those with long hair to death
llm_translation: The text states: If the drinking of wine is prohibited for those who are under the obligation of letting their hair grow long, as it is written: "They shall not shave their heads, nor shall they let their hair grow long," and it is also written: "Nor shall they drink wine, etc." Just as the drinking of wine is prohibited in death, so too the letting of hair grow long is prohibited in death.

hebrew_text: וּמִינַּהּ: מָה שְׁתוּיֵי יַיִן דְּמַחֲלִי עֲבוֹדָה – אַף פְּרוּעֵי רֹאשׁ דְּמַחֲלִי עֲבוֹדָה. קַשְׁיָא!
human_translation: And from this just as drunk on wine desecrate the service, so too, those with long hair desecrate the service, a difficulty.
llm_translation: And the heretic: What is the case of wine that is poured for idolatry - so too the loosening of the hair is considered idolatry. A difficulty!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבִינָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: הַאי, עַד דְּלָא אֲתָא יְחֶזְקֵאל, מַאן אַמְרַהּ? וְלִיטַעְמָיךְ, הָא דְּאָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: דָּבָר זֶה מִתּוֹרַת מֹשֶׁה רַבֵּינוּ לֹא לָמַדְנוּ, עַד שֶׁבָּא יְחֶזְקֵאל וְלִימְּדָנוּ: ״כׇּל בֶּן נֵכָר עֶרֶל לֵב וְעֶרֶל בָּשָׂר לֹא יָבוֹא אֶל מִקְדָּשִׁי לְשָׁרְתֵנִי״, עַד דְּלֹא בָּא יְחֶזְקֵאל מַאן אַמְרַהּ? אֶלָּא, גְּמָרָא גְּמִירִי לַהּ, וַאֲתָא יְחֶזְקֵאל וְאַסְמְכַהּ אַקְּרָא. הָכָא נָמֵי, גְּמָרָא גְּמִירִי לַהּ, וַאֲתָא יְחֶזְקֵאל וְאַסְמְכַהּ אַקְּרָא.
human_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: This until Ezekiel came who said it? And according to your reasoning, this that Rav Ḥisda says: We did not learn this matter from the Torah of Moses, our teacher, until Ezekiel came and taught us: “No stranger, uncircumcised in heart and uncircumcised in flesh, shall enter into My Sanctuary to serve Me” until Ezekiel came who said it? Rather, is learned as a tradition and Ezekiel came and gave it support by a verse. Here too, is learned as a tradition, and Ezekiel came and gave it support by a verse.
llm_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: Until Ezekiel does not come, who said it? And to support it, this that Rav Hisda said: This matter we did not learn from the Torah of Moses our teacher until Ezekiel came and taught us: "No foreigner, uncircumcised in heart and uncircumcised in flesh, shall enter My sanctuary to serve Me." Until Ezekiel came, who said it? Rather, we establish it through logical reasoning, and Ezekiel came and supported it with a verse. Here too, we establish it through logical reasoning, and Ezekiel came and supported it with a verse.

hebrew_text: וְכִי גָמְרִי הֲלָכָה לְמִיתָה, לְאַחוֹלֵי עֲבוֹדָה לָא גְּמִירִי.
human_translation: And when they learned halakha , to death that desecration of the service is not learned
llm_translation: And when they have completed the halakha for death penalty, for the eating of sacrifices they have not completed.

hebrew_text: מַאי ״כָּסוֹם יִכְסְמוּ אֶת רָאשֵׁיהֶם״? תָּנָא: כְּמִין תִּסְפּוֹרֶת לוּלְיָינִית. מַאי תִּסְפּוֹרֶת לוּלְיָינִית? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: תִּסְפּוּרְתָּא יְחִידָאָה. הֵיכִי דָּמֵי? אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: רֹאשׁוֹ שֶׁל זֶה בְּצַד עִיקָּרוֹ שֶׁל זֶה.
human_translation: What “they shall trim only their heads” taught Like a lulyanit haircut. What a lulyanit haircut? Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: A unique haircut. What is it like? Rav Ashi says: the head of this at the side of the bottom of that
llm_translation: What is "they shall cover their heads"? It was taught: Like a Lu'liyanit species. What is a Lu'liyanit species? Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: A single species. How so? Rav Ashe said: The head of this one alongside the root of that one.

hebrew_text: שָׁאֲלוּ אֶת רַבִּי: אֵיזֶהוּ תִּסְפּוֹרֶת שֶׁל כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל? אָמַר לָהֶן: צְאוּ וּרְאוּ מִתִּסְפּוֹרֶת שֶׁל בֶּן אֶלְעָשָׂה. תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: לֹא עַל חִנָּם פִּיזֵּר בֶּן אֶלְעָשָׂה אֶת מְעוֹתָיו, אֶלָּא כְּדֵי לְהַרְאוֹת בּוֹ תִּסְפּוֹרֶת שֶׁל כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל.
human_translation: asked Rabbi What was the haircut of the High Priest? He said to them: Go out and see the haircut of ben Elasa, It is taught Rabbi says: Not for nothing did ben Elasa disburse his money but in order to demonstrate the haircut of the High Priest.
llm_translation: They asked Rabbi: What is the counting of the High Priest? He said to them: Go and see the counting of the descendants of El'asah. It was taught: Rabbi says: Ben El'asah did not distribute his coins gratuitously, but in order to demonstrate through him the counting of the High Priest.

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל.
llm_translation: We will return to you, High Priest.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ דִּינֵי מָמוֹנוֹת בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה. זֶה בּוֹרֵר לוֹ אֶחָד, וְזֶה בּוֹרֵר לוֹ אֶחָד, וּשְׁנֵיהֶן בּוֹרְרִין לָהֶן עוֹד אֶחָד, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: שְׁנֵי דַיָּינִין בּוֹרְרִין לָהֶן עוֹד אֶחָד.
human_translation: monetary law by three. This chooses one for himself and that chooses one for himself, and the two of them choose one more for themselves; the statement of Rabbi Meir. And the Rabbis say: two judges choose one more for themselves.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: Monetary cases are adjudicated by three. This one chooses one judge for himself, and this one chooses one judge for himself, and both of them choose another judge for themselves, according to the words of Rabbi Meir. But the Sages say: Two judges choose another judge for themselves.

hebrew_text: זֶה פּוֹסֵל דַּיָּינוֹ שֶׁל זֶה, וְזֶה פּוֹסֵל דַּיָּינוֹ שֶׁל זֶה – דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֵימָתַי? בִּזְמַן שֶׁמֵּבִיא עֲלֵיהֶן רְאָיָה שֶׁהֵן קְרוֹבִין אוֹ פְּסוּלִין. אֲבָל אִם הָיוּ כְּשֵׁרִין אוֹ מוּמְחִין מִפִּי בֵּית דִּין – אֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לְפוֹסְלָן.
human_translation: This disqualify the judge by that and that disqualify the judge by this the statement of Rabbi Meir. And the Rabbis say: When when he brings evidence about them that they are related or disqualified But if they are fit or are experts by the court, he cannot disqualify them.
llm_translation: This disqualifies the witness of this one, and this disqualifies the witness of that one - the words of Rabbi Meir. And the sages say: When? At a time when one brings evidence upon them that they are either relatives or disqualified. But if they were valid witnesses or blemished according to the court - he cannot disqualify them.

hebrew_text: זֶה פּוֹסֵל עֵדָיו שֶׁל זֶה, וְזֶה פּוֹסֵל עֵדָיו שֶׁל זֶה. דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֵימָתַי? בִּזְמַן שֶׁמֵּבִיא עֲלֵיהֶן רְאָיָה שֶׁהֵן קְרוֹבִין אוֹ פְּסוּלִין, אֲבָל אִם הָיוּ כְּשֵׁרִין – אֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לְפוֹסְלָן.
human_translation: This disqualify the witnesses of that and that disqualify the witnesses of this the statement of Rabbi Meir. And the Rabbis say: When when he brings evidence about them that they are related or disqualified But if they are fit he cannot disqualify them.
llm_translation: This disqualifies the witnesses of this one, and this disqualifies the witnesses of this one. These are the words of Rabbi Meir. And the sages say: When? At a time when one brings evidence against them that they are relatives or invalid, but if they were valid - he cannot disqualify them.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי ״זֶה בּוֹרֵר לוֹ אֶחָד וְזֶה בּוֹרֵר לוֹ אֶחָד״? בִּתְלָתָא סַגִּי!
human_translation: what this choose one for himself and that choose one for himself; sufficient with three
llm_translation: Gemara: What is the meaning of "This one selects for him one and this one selects for him one"? In three aspects!

hebrew_text: הָכִי קָאָמַר: כְּשֶׁזֶּה בּוֹרֵר לוֹ בֵּית דִּין אֶחָד, וְזֶה בּוֹרֵר לוֹ בֵּית דִּין אֶחָד, שְׁנֵיהֶן בּוֹרְרִין לָהֶן עוֹד אֶחָד.
human_translation: This is saying: where this chooses one court for himself, and that chooses one court for himself, both of them choose one more for themselves,
llm_translation: So it is stated: When this one chooses for himself one court, and that one chooses for himself one court, both of them choose for themselves another one.

hebrew_text: וַאֲפִילּוּ לֹוֶה מָצֵי מְעַכֵּב? וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא מַלְוֶה, אֲבָל לֹוֶה כּוֹפִין אוֹתוֹ וְדָן בְּעִירוֹ.
human_translation: And can even a debtor restrict But doesn’t Rabbi Elazar say: taught only a creditor but a debtor, they compel him presides in his city.
llm_translation: "And even if he finds the lender delaying? But didn't Rabbi Elazar say: They only taught this law regarding lending, but if one borrows, they can compel him and judge him in his city."

hebrew_text: כִּדְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: בְּעַרְכָּאוֹת שֶׁבְּסוּרְיָא שָׁנוּ. הָכָא נָמֵי, בְּעַרְכָּאוֹת שֶׁבְּסוּרְיָא שָׁנוּ. אֲבָל מוּמְחִין – לָא.
human_translation: as Rabbi Yoḥanan says taught with regard to courts [ be’arkaot ] in Syria. Here too, taught with regard to courts in Syria, But experts, not
llm_translation: As Rabbi Yochanan said: In the orchards of Surya they taught. Here too, in the orchards of Surya they taught. But in Mochin - no.

hebrew_text: רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא מוּמְחִין, כְּגוֹן בֵּי דִינָא דְּרַב הוּנָא וּדְרַב חִסְדָּא, דְּקָאָמַר לֵיהּ: מִי קָא מַטְרַחְנָא לָךְ?
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: You even say experts such as the courts of Rav Huna and of Rav Ḥisda. As can say to Am I burdening you
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: Even if they say "we are experts," such as the court of Rav Huna and Rav Hisda, who say to him: "Who is bothering you?"

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים, שְׁנֵי דַיָּינִין בּוֹרְרִין לָהֶן עוֹד אֶחָד. וְאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ כִּדְקָאָמְרִינַן בֵּית דִּין – בֵּית דִּין בָּתַר דְּפָסְלִי לְהוּ, אָזְלוּ וּבָרְרוּ לְהוּ בֵּי דִינָא אַחֲרִינֵי?
human_translation: We learned And the Rabbis say: two judges choose one more for themselves. And if it enters your mind as we said a court after court was disqualified go and choose another court for themselves?
llm_translation: We learned: And the sages say, two judges may choose for themselves another one. And if it enters your mind, as we say in the court - after the court disqualified them, do they go and choose for themselves another court?

hebrew_text: וְעוֹד, מַאי ״זֶה בּוֹרֵר לוֹ אֶחָד וְזֶה בּוֹרֵר לוֹ אֶחָד״?
human_translation: And furthermore, what this chooses one for himself and that chooses one for himself,
llm_translation: And furthermore, what is "this one sifts for him one and this one sifts for him one"?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא הָכִי קָאָמַר: כְּשֶׁזֶּה בּוֹרֵר לוֹ דַּיָּין אֶחָד, וְזֶה בּוֹרֵר לוֹ דַּיָּין אֶחָד, שְׁנֵיהֶן בּוֹרְרִין לָהֶן עוֹד אֶחָד.
human_translation: Rather, this is saying: When this chooses one judge for himself and that chooses one judge for himself the two choose one more for themselves,
llm_translation: Rather, thus he said: When this one chooses for himself one judge, and this one chooses for himself one judge, both of them choose for themselves another judge.

hebrew_text: מַאי שְׁנָא דְּעָבְדִי הָכִי? אָמְרִי בְּמַעְרְבָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי זֵירָא: מִתּוֹךְ שֶׁזֶּה בּוֹרֵר לוֹ דַּיָּין אֶחָד, וְזֶה בּוֹרֵר לוֹ דַּיָּין אֶחָד, וּשְׁנֵיהֶן בּוֹרְרִין לָהֶן עוֹד אֶחָד – יֵצֵא הַדִּין לַאֲמִיתּוֹ.
human_translation: What is different that performed in this in the West, say in the name of Rabbi Zeira: As a result of that this chooses one judge for himself, and that chooses one judge for himself, and the two choose one more for themselves, the true judgment will emerge.
llm_translation: What is different about what they do? They say in the West in the name of Rabbi Zeira: Because this one chooses one judge for himself, and that one chooses one judge for himself, and both of them choose another judge for themselves - the judgment is valid.

hebrew_text: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים כּוּ׳. נֵימָא בִּדְרַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב קָמִיפַּלְגִי?
human_translation: And the Rabbis say: Let us say disagree with regard to what Rav Yehuda Rav says.
llm_translation: The Sages say: "Let us say in the name of Rav Yehudah who said, Rav Kamifalgi?"

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: אֵין הָעֵדִים חוֹתְמִין עַל הַשְּׁטָר אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן יוֹדְעִין מִי חוֹתֵם עִמָּהֶן. רַבִּי מֵאִיר לֵית לֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב, וְרַבָּנַן אִית לְהוּ דְּרַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב.
human_translation: As Rav Yehuda says Rav says: Witnesses do not sign a document unless they know who is signing with them. Rabbi Meir does not accept that which Rav Yehuda Rav says. And the Rabbis accept that which Rav Yehuda Rav says;
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: Witnesses do not sign on the document unless they know who is signing with them. Rabbi Meir does not hold like Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav, but the Rabbis hold like Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav."

hebrew_text: לָא, דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא אִית לְהוּ דְּרַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב, וְדַעַת הַדַּיָּינִין – כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דְּבָעֵינַן. כִּי פְּלִיגִי – דַּעַת בַּעֲלֵי דִינִין: רַבִּי מֵאִיר סָבַר דַּעַת בַּעֲלֵי דִינִין נָמֵי בָּעֵינַן, וְרַבָּנַן סָבְרִי דַּעַת הַדַּיָּינִין בָּעֵינַן, דַּעַת בַּעֲלֵי דִינִין לָא בָּעֵינַן.
human_translation: No, everyone accepts that which Rav Yehuda Rav says; and everyone agrees that we need the consent of the judges when they disagree, the consent of the litigants Rabbi Meir holds we need the consent of the litigants as well, and the Rabbis hold we need the consent of the judges, we do not need the consent of the litigants.
llm_translation: Not, for all the world there is to him of Rav Yehudah said Rav, and the opinion of the judges - all the world do not argue that we need. When they argue - the opinion of the judges: Rabbi Meir holds that we also need the opinion of the judges, and the Rabbis hold that we need the opinion of the judges, we do not need the opinion of the judges.

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא, אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: אֵין הָעֵדִים חוֹתְמִין עַל הַשְּׁטָר כּוּ׳. תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: כָּךְ הָיוּ נְקִיֵּי הַדַּעַת שֶׁבִּירוּשָׁלַיִם עוֹשִׂין – לֹא הָיוּ חוֹתְמִין עַל הַשְּׁטָר אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן יוֹדְעִין מִי חוֹתֵם עִמָּהֶן, וְלֹא הָיוּ יוֹשְׁבִין בְּדִין אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן יוֹדְעִין מִי יוֹשֵׁב עִמָּהֶן, וְלֹא הָיוּ נִכְנָסִין בִּסְעוּדָה אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן יוֹדְעִין מִי מֵסֵב עִמָּהֶן.
human_translation: the itself, Rav Yehuda says Rav says: Witnesses do not sign a document That is also taught This is what the scrupulous people of Jerusalem would do: They would not sign a document unless they knew who was signing with them, and they would not sit in judgment unless they knew who was sitting with them, and they would not join a meal unless they knew who was reclining, with them.
llm_translation: The body, Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: The witnesses do not sign on the document. It was also taught likewise: This is how the trustworthy individuals in Jerusalem used to conduct themselves - they would not sign on the document unless they knew who was signing with them, and they would not sit in judgment unless they knew who was sitting with them, and they would not partake in a meal unless they knew who was eating with them.

hebrew_text: זֶה פּוֹסֵל דַּיָּינוֹ כּוּ׳. כֹּל כְּמִינֵּיהּ דְּפָסֵיל דַּיָּינֵי?
human_translation: This disqualify the judge Is it in his to disqualify judges?
llm_translation: This disqualifies our wine. Any similar type that disqualifies wine?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: בְּעַרְכָּאוֹת שֶׁבְּסוּרְיָא שָׁנוּ, אֲבָל מוּמְחִים – לֹא.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: taught with regard to courts in Syria. But not expert
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yochanan: In the orchards of Surya they permitted, but in Mochim they did not.

hebrew_text: הָא מִדְּקָתָנֵי סֵיפָא: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים, אֵימָתַי? בִּזְמַן שֶׁמֵּבִיא רְאָיָה שֶׁהֵן קְרוֹבִין אוֹ פְּסוּלִין. אֲבָל אִם הָיוּ כְּשֵׁרִין, אוֹ מוּמְחִין מִפִּי בֵּית דִּין – אֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לְפוֹסְלָן, מִכְּלָל דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר מוּמְחִין נָמֵי קָאָמַר!
human_translation: From that teaches the latter clause: And the Rabbis say: When When he brings evidence that they are related or disqualified but if they are fit or are experts by the court, he cannot disqualify them. By inference, Rabbi Meir is also speaking experts
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches in its conclusion: And the Sages say, when is this applicable? When one brings evidence that they are either valid or invalid. But if they were valid, or were declared invalid by the court – he cannot disqualify them. This is implicit in the statement of Rabbi Meir that even if they were declared invalid.

hebrew_text: הָכִי קָאָמַר: אֲבָל אִם הָיוּ כְּשֵׁרִין, נַעֲשׂוּ כְּמוּמְחִין מִפִּי בֵּית דִּין, וְאֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לְפוֹסְלָן.
human_translation: This saying: But if they are fit they are treated like experts by the court, and he cannot disqualify them.
llm_translation: So he said: But if they were valid, they would be considered as blemished from the mouth of the court, and he cannot disqualify them.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: אָמְרוּ לוֹ לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר, לֹא כׇּל הֵימֶנּוּ שֶׁפּוֹסֵל דַּיָּין שֶׁמּוּמְחֶה לְרַבִּים.
human_translation: Come hear said to Rabbi Meir: It is not within to disqualify a judge who an expert for the public.
llm_translation: Come and hear: They said to Rabbi Meir, not everyone who disqualifies a judge is considered a blemish that causes joy to the public.

hebrew_text: אֵימָא: לֹא כׇּל הֵימֶנּוּ שֶׁפּוֹסֵל דַּיָּין שֶׁהִמְחוּהוּ רַבִּים עֲלֵיהֶם.
human_translation: Say It is not within to disqualify a judge whom the public accepted upon themselves as an expert
llm_translation: Concerning what? Not everyone disqualifies a judge whom many have appointed over them.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: לְעוֹלָם פּוֹסֵל וְהוֹלֵךְ, עַד שֶׁיְּקַבֵּל עָלָיו בֵּית דִּין שֶׁמּוּמְחֶה לְרַבִּים. דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר.
human_translation: That is also taught can continuously disqualify forever, until accepts a court that an expert for the public; the statement of Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: It was taught in a baraita: Namai the Elder said: Always disqualify and walk away, until the court accepts upon itself that which brings joy to the public. These are the words of Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: וְהָא עֵדִים כְּמוּמְחִין דָּמֵי? וְאָמַר רַבִּי מֵאִיר: זֶה פּוֹסֵל עֵדָיו שֶׁל זֶה, וְזֶה פּוֹסֵל עֵדָיו שֶׁל זֶה.
human_translation: But aren’t witnesses like experts, And Rabbi Meir says: This can disqualify the witnesses of that and that can disqualify the witnesses of this
llm_translation: And this, witnesses are like those who blemish blood? And Rabbi Meir said: This disqualifies the witnesses of this one, and this disqualifies the witnesses of that one.

hebrew_text: הָא אִיתְּמַר עֲלַהּ, אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: פֶּה קָדוֹשׁ יֹאמַר דָּבָר זֶה? תְּנִי: ״עֵדוֹ״.
human_translation: It was stated with regard to that Reish Lakish says: Would a holy mouth, say this statement, teach: His witness,
llm_translation: The Gemara: If it was said about him, Reish Lakish said: Should the Holy Mouth say this matter? It was taught: "His witness."

hebrew_text: עֵדוֹ לְמַאי? אִילֵימָא לְמָמוֹן, רַחֲמָנָא פַּסְלֵיהּ! אִי לִשְׁבוּעָה, הֵימוֹנֵי מְהֵימַן כְּבֵי תְּרֵי!
human_translation: For what his witness If we say to monetary matters, the Merciful One disqualifies him, If to an oath is deemed credible like two
llm_translation: Witness for what? If you say for money, may the Merciful One invalidate it! If for an oath, the trustworthiness of two is like the trustworthiness of three!

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם לְמָמוֹן. לָא צְרִיכָא, דְּקַבְּלֵיהּ עֲלֵיהּ כְּבֵי תְרֵי.
human_translation: Actually, to monetary matters; no, necessary where accepted upon himself as two
llm_translation: Forever for money. Not necessary, for he received it upon him like two houses.

hebrew_text: מַאי קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן: דְּמָצֵי הָדַר בֵּיהּ? תְּנֵינָא: אָמַר לוֹ ״נֶאֱמָן עָלַי אַבָּא״, ״נֶאֱמָן עָלַי אָבִיךָ״, ״נֶאֱמָנִין עָלַי שְׁלֹשָׁה רוֹעֵי בָּקָר״ – רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: יָכוֹל לַחֲזוֹר בּוֹ, וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לַחֲזוֹר בּוֹ.
human_translation: What is this teaching us, that one can retract We learn says to My father is trusted for me, Your father is trusted for me, Three cattle herders, are trusted for me, Rabbi Meir says can retract it; and the Rabbis say he cannot retract it,
llm_translation: What is implied to us? That he can retract from it? We learned: He said to him, "Trustworthy upon me, father," "Trustworthy upon me, your father," "Trustworthy upon me three cattle herders" - Rabbi Meir says: He can retract, and the Sages say: He cannot retract.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב דִּימִי בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יוֹסֵף: כְּגוֹן דְּקַבְּלֵיהּ עֲלֵיהּ בְּחַד.
human_translation: And Rav Dimi, son of Rav Naḥman, son of Rav Yosef, says: where accepted upon himself as one
llm_translation: And Rav Dimi, son of Rav Nachman, son of Rav Yosef, said: For example, that he received it upon him in one.

hebrew_text: צְרִיכָא, דְּאִי תְּנָא ״אַבָּא״ וְ״אָבִיךְ״ – בְּהָא קָאָמְרִי רַבָּנַן דְּלָא מָצֵי הָדַר בֵּיהּ, מִשּׁוּם דְּאַבָּא וְאָבִיךְ חֲזוּ לְעָלְמָא. אֲבָל חַד כְּבֵי תְרֵי, דִּלְעָלְמָא לָא חֲזֵי – אֵימָא: מוֹדוּ לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר.
human_translation: necessary. As, had taught My father or: Your father in this did the Rabbis say that he cannot retract because: My father, and: Your father, are fit to the general public. But one as two who is not fit to the general public say concede to Rabbi Meir
llm_translation: The matter is, for if a Tanna were to teach "father" and "your father" - in this case the Rabbis would say that it cannot be reconciled, because "father" and "your father" refer to the same thing. But if it were two different houses, which are not seen in the world - say: let them admit to Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: וְאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן בְּהָא, בְּהָא קָאָמַר רַבִּי מֵאִיר, אֲבָל בְּהַהִיא – אֵימָא מוֹדוּ לְהוּ לְרַבָּנַן. צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: And if would teach us with regard to this in this Rabbi Meir says But in that say concedes to the Rabbis necessary
llm_translation: And if we were to hear in this case, in this case Rabbi Meir is saying, but in that case - say they agree with the Rabbis. This is necessary.

hebrew_text: הָא מִדְּקָתָנֵי רֵישָׁא ״דַּיָּינוֹ״, וְסֵיפָא ״עֵדָיו״ – אַלְמָא דַּוְקָא קָתָנֵי.
human_translation: But from that the former clause teaches the judge, by and the latter clause his witnesses, evidently teaches specifically
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches in the beginning "dayano," and in the end "edav" - this specifically is what it teaches.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: בְּבָא הוּא וְאַחֵר לְפוֹסְלָן.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: where and another come to disqualify
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: "With a 'Bava' he comes, and another one invalidates them."

hebrew_text: כֹּל כְּמִינֵּיהּ? נוֹגֵעַ בְּעֵדוּתוֹ הוּא!
human_translation: Is it in his His testimony is a conflict of interest;
llm_translation: All like its kind? He touches upon its testimony!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִיקָא: כְּגוֹן שֶׁקָּרָא עָלָיו עַרְעָר.
human_translation: Rav Aḥa, son of Rav Ika, said: where he raised a challenge against
llm_translation: Said Rav Acha son of Rav Ika: For example, when he read upon him a curse.

hebrew_text: עַרְעָר דְּמַאי? אִילֵּימָא עַרְעָר דְּגַזְלָנוּתָא, כֹּל כְּמִינֵּיהּ? נוֹגֵעַ בְּעֵדוּתוֹ הוּא!
human_translation: A challenge over which If we say a challenge of theft is it in his His testimony is a conflict of interest.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "What is the case of 'Ar'ar? If you say it is the case of robbery, is it like its kind? It affects his testimony!"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: עַרְעָר דִּפְגַם מִשְׁפָּחָה. רַבִּי מֵאִיר סָבַר: הָנֵי אַמִּשְׁפָּחָה קָמַסְהֲדִי, וְאִיהוּ מִמֵּילָא קָפָסֵיל. וְרַבָּנַן סָבְרִי: סוֹף סוֹף נוֹגֵעַ בְּעֵדוּתוֹ הוּא.
human_translation: Rather, a challenge over a family flaw. Rabbi Meir holds these are testifying about the family and is disqualified indirectly. And the Rabbis hold his testimony is ultimately a conflict of interest,
llm_translation: Rather: a blemished member of the family. Rabbi Meir holds: those family members are trustworthy, but he is unreliable. And the Rabbis hold: ultimately, he will touch upon his testimony.

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא רַב דִּימִי, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מַחֲלוֹקֶת בִּשְׁתֵּי כִּיתֵּי עֵדִים.
human_translation: When Rav Dimi came Rabbi Yoḥanan says: The dispute is with regard to two sets of witnesses
llm_translation: When Rav Dimi came, Rabbi Yochanan said: A dispute regarding two groups of witnesses.

hebrew_text: דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר סָבַר: צָרִיךְ לְבָרֵר, וְרַבָּנַן סָבְרִי: אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ לְבָרֵר. אֲבָל בְּכַת אַחַת – דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל אֵין יָכוֹל לְפוֹסְלָן.
human_translation: Rabbi Meir as holds is required to substantiate And the Rabbis hold is not required to substantiate But in one set everyone agrees cannot disqualify them,
llm_translation: Rabbi Meir holds: It is necessary to clarify, and the Rabbis hold: It is not necessary to clarify. But in one case - everyone agrees that he cannot disqualify them.

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ לְפָנָיו רַב אַמֵּי וְרַב אַסִּי: אֵין שָׁם אֶלָּא כַּת אַחַת, מַהוּ?
human_translation: Rav Ami and Rav Asi said before is only one set there, what is
llm_translation: They said before him, Rav Ammi and Rav Assi: There is only one "kot" there, what is it?

hebrew_text: אֵין שָׁם אֶלָּא כַּת אַחַת? וְהָאָמְרַתְּ: אֲבָל בְּכַת אַחַת דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל אֵין יָכוֹל לְפוֹסְלָן! אֶלָּא, נִמְצֵאת כַּת שְׁנִיָּה קְרוֹבִין אוֹ פְסוּלִין – מַהוּ?
human_translation: is only one set there, But didn’t you say: But in one set everyone agrees cannot disqualify them? Rather, the second set is found to be related or is disqualified what is
llm_translation: There is only one kidney there? But you said: But with one kidney, everyone cannot disqualify them! Rather, if a second kidney is found, are they considered close or disqualified?

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָהֶן: כְּבָר הֵעִידוּ עֵדִים הָרִאשׁוֹנִים. אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי, אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: כְּבָר הֵעִידוּ עֵדִים הָרִאשׁוֹנִים.
human_translation: said to them: The first witnesses, already testified. Some say Rav Ashi says: The first witnesses already testified.
llm_translation: He said to them: The first witnesses have already testified. Some say, Rav Ashi said: The first witnesses have already testified.

hebrew_text: נֵימָא, בִּפְלוּגְתָּא דְּרַבִּי וְרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל קָמִיפַּלְגִי?
human_translation: Shall we say disagree with regard to the dispute between Rabbi and Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel?
llm_translation: Nayma, in the dispute of Rabbi and Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, did he divide?

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: הַבָּא לִידּוֹן בִּשְׁטָר וּבַחֲזָקָה, נִידּוֹן בִּשְׁטָר – דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: נִידּוֹן בַּחֲזָקָה.
human_translation: As it is taught one who comes to be judged with a deed and with presumptive ownership is judged on the basis of the deed. the statement of Rabbi Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: is judged on the basis of presumptive ownership.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: If one comes to be judged based on a document and based on possession, he is judged based on the document - these are the words of Rabbi. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: He is judged based on possession.

hebrew_text: וְהָוֵינַן בַּהּ: בַּחֲזָקָה וְלֹא בִּשְׁטָר? אֶלָּא אֵימָא: אַף בַּחֲזָקָה.
human_translation: And we discussed on the basis of presumptive ownership and not on the basis of deed, Rather, say even on the basis of presumptive ownership.
llm_translation: We ask in it: with a presumption and not with a document? Rather say: even with a presumption.

hebrew_text: וְקַיְימָא לַן, דִּבְצָרִיךְ לְבָרֵר פְּלִיגִי.
human_translation: And we maintain that they disagree with regard to required to substantiate
llm_translation: And it is established for us, that it is necessary to clarify their dispute.

hebrew_text: לָא. אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי. כִּי פְּלִיגִי, אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי. דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר כְּרַבִּי.
human_translation: No. According to of Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, everyone agrees When disagree according to of Rabbi as Rabbi Meir in accordance with Rabbi
llm_translation: Not. In the school of Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, everyone does not argue. When they argue, in the school of Rabbi. Rabbi Meir is like Rabbi.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן אָמְרִי לָךְ: עַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמַר רַבִּי הָתָם אֶלָּא בַּחֲזָקָה, דְּמִכֹּחַ שְׁטָרָא קָאָתֵי. אֲבָל הָכָא, דְּהָנֵי עֵדִים לָאו מִכֹּחַ עֵדִים אַחֲרִינֵי קָאָתוּ, אֲפִילּוּ רַבִּי מוֹדֶה דְּאֵין צָרִיךְ לְבָרֵר.
human_translation: And the Rabbis said to you Rabbi says there only vis-à-vis presumptive ownership as comes from the power of the deed; But here, since these witnesses does not come from the power of the other witnesses, even Rabbi concedes that one is not required to substantiate
llm_translation: The sages say to you: Until here, Rabbi did not say except in a presumption, for he relies on the power of the document. But here, where these witnesses do not rely on the power of other witnesses, even Rabbi agrees that clarification is not necessary.

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא רָבִין, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: רֵישָׁא
human_translation: When Ravin came Rabbi Yoḥanan says The former clause,
llm_translation: When Ravin came, Rabbi Yochanan said: "The beginning..."

hebrew_text: בְּעֵדִים פְּסוּלִין וְדַיָּינִין כְּשֵׁרִין, מִיגּוֹ דְּפָסְלִי עֵידֵי – פָּסְלִי נָמֵי דַּיָּינֵי. סֵיפָא: בְּדַיָּינִין פְּסוּלִין וְעֵדִים כְּשֵׁרִין, דְּמִיגּוֹ דְּפָסְלִי דַּיָּינֵי – פָּסְלִי נָמֵי עֵידֵי.
human_translation: with regard to disqualified witnesses and fit judges, since the witnesses are disqualified the judges are also disqualified, The latter clause, with regard to disqualified judges and fit witnesses, Since the judges are disqualified the witnesses were also disqualified.
llm_translation: In witnesses, disqualified, and judges, valid, because when witnesses disqualify - they also disqualify judges. The latter clause: In judges, disqualified, and witnesses, valid, because when judges disqualify - they also disqualify witnesses.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רָבָא: בִּשְׁלָמָא, מִיגּוֹ דְּפָסְלִי עֵדֵי פָּסְלִי נָמֵי דַּיָּינֵי, אִיכָּא בֵּי דִינָא אַחֲרִינָא. אֶלָּא מִיגּוֹ דְּפָסְלִי דַּיָּינֵי פָּסְלִי נָמֵי עֵדֵי? וְהָא עֵדִים תּוּ לֵיכָּא!
human_translation: Rava objects to this Granted, since the witnesses are disqualified the judges are also disqualified, there is another court, But since the judges are disqualified, the witnesses are also disqualified there are no more witnesses.
llm_translation: Rava objects to this: Granted, if the witnesses of the witnesses are disqualified, there may be another court. But if the witnesses themselves are disqualified, are there other witnesses? But are there not witnesses?!

hebrew_text: לָא צְרִיכָא, דְּאִיכָּא כַּת אַחֶרֶת.
human_translation: No, necessary where there is another set
llm_translation: Not necessary, for there is another opinion.

hebrew_text: הָא לֵיכָּא כַּת אַחֶרֶת, מַאי? הָכִי נָמֵי דְּלָא מָצֵי פָּסְלִי? הַיְינוּ דְּרַב דִּימִי!
human_translation: But there is no other set what indeed that cannot disqualify this is Rav Dimi’s
llm_translation: Here is another opinion, what is it? Is it also because the idol cannot be found? That is the opinion of Rav Dimi!

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ מִיגּוֹ, דְּמָר סָבַר: אָמְרִינַן מִיגּוֹ, וּמָר סָבַר: לָא אָמְרִינַן מִיגּוֹ.
human_translation: There is between them since [ miggo ] As Sage, holds we say miggo , and Sage, holds we do not say miggo ,
llm_translation: There is a difference between them regarding the "migo," as Master A holds: we say "migo," and Master B holds: we do not say "migo."

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא, אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: פֶּה קָדוֹשׁ יֹאמַר דָּבָר זֶה? תְּנִי: ״עֵדוֹ״.
human_translation: the itself: Reish Lakish says: Would a holy mouth, say this statement, teach: His witness,
llm_translation: The body, Reish Lakish said: Does the Holy Mouth say this matter? It was taught: "His witness."

hebrew_text: אִינִי? וְהָאָמַר עוּלָּא: הָרוֹאֶה אֶת רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ בְּבֵית הַמִּדְרָשׁ, כְּאִילּוּ עוֹקֵר הָרִים וְטוֹחֲנָן זֶה בָּזֶה.
human_translation: Is that so? But doesn’t Ulla say: one sees Reish Lakish in the study hall as though he is uprooting mountains and grinding them into each other?
llm_translation: I? And did not Ulla say: One who sees Reish Lakish in the study hall, it is as if he is uprooting mountains and grinding them against each other.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבִינָא: וַהֲלֹא כׇּל הָרוֹאֶה רַבִּי מֵאִיר בְּבֵית הַמִּדְרָשׁ, כְּאִילּוּ עוֹקֵר הָרֵי הָרִים וְטוֹחֲנָן זֶה בָּזֶה!
human_translation: Ravina said But is it not anyone sees Rabbi Meir in the study hall, as though he is uprooting the highest of mountains and grinding them into each other?
llm_translation: Ravina said: But does not anyone who sees Rabbi Meir in the study hall, it is as if he uproots mountains and grinds them against each other!

hebrew_text: הָכִי קָאָמַר: בָּא וּרְאֵה כַּמָּה מְחַבְּבִין זֶה אֶת זֶה.
human_translation: this is saying, Come and see how much love each other.
llm_translation: So it is stated: "Come and see how beloved one is to another."

hebrew_text: כִּי הָא דְּיָתֵיב רַבִּי וְקָאָמַר: אָסוּר לְהַטְמִין אֶת הַצּוֹנֵן. אָמַר לְפָנָיו רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי: אַבָּא הִתִּיר לְהַטְמִין אֶת הַצּוֹנֵן. אָמַר לָהֶם: כְּבָר הוֹרָה זָקֵן.
human_translation: like that where Rabbi sat and said: It is prohibited to insulate cold Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei, said before him: My father permitted to insulate cold said to the elder, has already issued a ruling
llm_translation: The one who sat, Rabbi, and said: It is forbidden to insulate the cold. Rabbi Yishmael son of Rabbi Yose said before him: Abba permitted to insulate the cold. He said to them: An elder has already taught.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: בֹּא וּרְאֵה כַּמָּה מְחַבְּבִין זֶה אֶת זֶה, דְּאִילּוּ רַבִּי יוֹסֵי קַיָּים הָיָה, כָּפוּף וְיוֹשֵׁב לִפְנֵי רַבִּי. דְּהָא רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי מְמַלֵּא מְקוֹם אֲבוֹתָיו הֲוָה, וְהָיָה כָּפוּף וְיוֹשֵׁב לִפְנֵי רַבִּי, וְקָא אָמַר: כְּבָר הוֹרָה זָקֵן.
human_translation: Rav Pappa says: Come and see how much they loved each other. As, had Rabbi Yosei been alive, he would have been subordinate and sitting before Rabbi as Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei, was his fathers’ replacement, and he was subordinate and sitting before Rabbi And, said: The elder has already issued a ruling
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: Come and see how beloved they were to one another, for if Rabbi Yosei had been alive, he would have bent over and sat before Rabbi. For Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei, would fill the place of his forefathers, and he would bend over and sit before Rabbi, and he would say: "An elder has already taught."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא: מַאי דִּכְתִיב ״וָאֶקַּח לִי אֶת שְׁנֵי מַקְלוֹת לְאַחַד קָרָאתִי נוֹעַם וּלְאַחַד קָרָאתִי חוֹבְלִים״? ״נוֹעַם״ – אֵלּוּ תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים שֶׁבְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל, שֶׁמַּנְעִימִין זֶה לָזֶה בַּהֲלָכָה. ״חוֹבְלִים״ – אֵלּוּ תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים שֶׁבְּבָבֶל, שֶׁמְּחַבְּלִים זֶה לָזֶה בַּהֲלָכָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Oshaya says: What which is written: “And I took for myself two staves; the one I called Graciousness, and the other I called Binders” “Graciousness”; these are Torah scholars in Eretz Yisrael, who are gracious to one another in halakha . “Binders [ ḥovelim ]”; these are Torah scholars in Babylonia, who injure [ shemeḥabbelim ] each other in halakha ,
llm_translation: Rabbi Oshaya said: What is the meaning of what is written, "And I took for myself two staffs, one I called Noam (Pleasantness) and one I called Hovlim (Bands)" (Zechariah 11:7)? "Noam" - these are the Torah scholars in the land of Israel, who make each other pleasant in matters of halakha. "Hovlim" - these are the Torah scholars in Babylonia, who challenge each other in matters of halakha.

hebrew_text: ״וַיֹּאמֶר אֵלַי אֵלֶּה [שְׁנֵי] בְנֵי הַיִּצְהָר הָעֹמְדִים וְגוֹ׳ וּשְׁנַיִם זֵיתִים עָלֶיהָ״. ״יִצְהָר״ – אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: אֵלּוּ תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים שֶׁבְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל, שֶׁנּוֹחִין זֶה לָזֶה בַּהֲלָכָה כְּשֶׁמֶן זַיִת. ״וּשְׁנַיִם זֵיתִים עָלֶיהָ״ – אֵלּוּ תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים שֶׁבְּבָבֶל, שֶׁמְּרוֹרִין זֶה לָזֶה בַּהֲלָכָה כְּזַיִת.
human_translation: “Then he said to me: These are the two anointed ones, that stand “And two olive trees by it, “anointed ones,” Rabbi Yitzḥak says: These are Torah scholars in Eretz Yisrael, who are pleasant to each other in halakha like olive oil, “and two olive trees by it” These are Torah scholars in Babylonia, who are bitter to each other in halakha like an olive.
llm_translation: "And He said to me, 'These are the two sons of the oil who stand...' 'Yitzhar' - Rabbi Yitzchak said: These are the students of the sages in the land of Israel, who support one another in halacha like olive oil. 'And two olive branches upon it' - These are the students of the sages in Babylon, who sharpen one another in halacha like olives."

hebrew_text: ״וָאֶשָּׂא עֵינַי וָאֵרֶא וְהִנֵּה שְׁתַּיִם נָשִׁים יוֹצְאוֹת וְרוּחַ בְּכַנְפֵיהֶם וְלָהֵנָּה כְנָפַיִם כְּכַנְפֵי הַחֲסִידָה וַתִּשֶּׂאנָה הָאֵיפָה בֵּין הַשָּׁמַיִם וּבֵין הָאָרֶץ. וָאֹמַר אֶל הַמַּלְאָךְ הַדֹּבֵר בִּי אָנָה הֵמָּה מוֹלִכוֹת אֶת הָאֵיפָה. וַיֹּאמֶר אֵלַי לִבְנוֹת לָה בַיִת בְּאֶרֶץ שִׁנְעָר״. אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַאי: זוֹ חֲנוּפָּה וְגַסּוּת הָרוּחַ שֶׁיָּרְדוּ לְבָבֶל.
human_translation: “Then I lifted my eyes and saw, and behold there came forth two women, and the wind was in their wings, for they had wings like the wings of a stork. And they lifted up the measure between the earth and the heaven. Then I said to the angel that spoke with me: To where do they take the measure? And he said to me: To build her a house in the land of Shinar” Rabbi Yoḥanan says in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai: This flattery and arrogance that descended to Babylonia,
llm_translation: "And I lifted my eyes and saw, and behold, two women were coming out, and wind was in their wings; and they had wings like the wings of a stork, and they lifted up the ephah between the earth and the sky. And I said to the angel who was speaking with me, 'Where are they taking the ephah?' And he said to me, 'To build for her a house in the land of Shinar.' Rabbi Yochanan said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai: This is hypocrisy and arrogance of spirit that descended to Babylon."

hebrew_text: וְגַסּוּת הָרוּחַ לְבָבֶל נְחִית? וְהָאָמַר מָר: עֲשָׂרָה קַבִּין גַּסּוּת יָרְדוּ לְעוֹלָם, תִּשְׁעָה נָטְלָה עֵילָם וְאַחַת כׇּל הָעוֹלָם כּוּלּוֹ!
human_translation: And did arrogance descend to Babylonia? But doesn’t the Master say: Ten kav arrogance descended to the world; Eilam took nine and all the world in its entirety one?
llm_translation: "And the arrogance of the spirit, did it descend to Babylon? And the Master said: Ten measures of arrogance descended to the world, nine took Elam, and one the entire world!"

hebrew_text: אִין, לְבָבֶל נְחִית, וְאִישְׁתַּרְבּוֹבֵי [הוּא] דְּאִישְׁתַּרְבַּב לְעֵילָם. דַּיְקָא נָמֵי, דִּכְתִיב: ״לִבְנוֹת לָה בַיִת בְּאֶרֶץ שִׁנְעָר״. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Yes, it descended to Babylonia, and it made its way to Eilam. is also precise, as it is written: “To build her a house in the land of Shinar,” Conclude from it
llm_translation: The text reads: "There is no descent to Babylon, and the city of Shinar will not be built up forever. This is precisely what is stated, as it is written: 'To build her a house in the land of Shinar.' Learn from it."

hebrew_text: וְהָאָמַר מָר: סִימָן לְגַסּוּת הָרוּחַ – עֲנִיּוּת, וַעֲנִיּוּת לְבָבֶל נְחִית! מַאי עֲנִיּוּת? עֲנִיּוּת תּוֹרָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״אָחוֹת לָנוּ קְטַנָּה וְשָׁדַיִם אֵין לָהּ״. אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: זוֹ עֵילָם, שֶׁזָּכְתָה לִלְמוֹד וְלֹא זָכְתָה לְלַמֵּד.
human_translation: But doesn’t the Master say: A sign of arrogance poverty? And poverty descended to Babylonia, what poverty poverty Torah, As it is written: “We have a little sister, and she has no breasts” Rabbi Yoḥanan says: This Eilam, whose merited to learn but did not merit to teach
llm_translation: The Master said: A sign of arrogance is poverty, and poverty leads to Babylon. What is poverty? The poverty of Torah, as it is written: "Our sister is young, and she has no breasts." Rabbi Yochanan said: This refers to Elam, who merited to learn but did not merit to teach.

hebrew_text: מַאי בָּבֶל? אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: בְּלוּלָה בַּמִּקְרָא, בְּלוּלָה בַּמִּשְׁנָה, בְּלוּלָה בַּתַּלְמוּד. ״בְּמַחֲשַׁכִּים הוֹשִׁיבַנִי כְּמֵתֵי עוֹלָם״ – אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה: זֶה תַּלְמוּדָהּ שֶׁל בָּבֶל.
human_translation: What Babylonia? Rabbi Yoḥanan says, mixed with Bible, mixed with Mishna, mixed with Talmud. “He has made me dwell in dark places, as those that have been long dead” Rabbi Yirmeya says: This is the Talmud of Babylonia,
llm_translation: What is Babylon? Rabbi Yochanan said: Confusion in Scripture, confusion in Mishnah, confusion in Talmud. "He has made me dwell in darkness like those long dead" - Rabbi Yirmiyah said: This is the Talmud of Babylon.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אָמַר לוֹ: ״נֶאֱמָן עָלַי אַבָּא״, ״נֶאֱמָן עָלַי אָבִיךָ״, ״נֶאֱמָנִים עָלַי שְׁלֹשָׁה רוֹעֵי בָּקָר״. רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: יָכוֹל לַחְזוֹר בּוֹ, וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לַחְזוֹר בּוֹ.
human_translation: says to My father is trusted for me, Your father is trusted for me, Three cattle herders, are trusted for me, Rabbi Meir says: can retract it, and the Rabbis say: He cannot retract it,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: He said to him, "Trustworthy upon me, Abba," "Trustworthy upon me, your father," "Trustworthy upon me, three cattle herders." Rabbi Meir says: He can retract, and the Sages say: He cannot retract.

hebrew_text: הָיָה חַיָּיב לַחֲבֵירוֹ שְׁבוּעָה, וְאָמַר לוֹ: ״דּוֹר לִי בְּחַיֵּי רֹאשֶׁךָ״. רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: יָכוֹל לַחְזוֹר בּוֹ, וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֵין יָכוֹל לַחְזוֹר בּוֹ.
human_translation: was obligated an oath to another, and said to him: vow to me by the life of your head Rabbi Meir says: can retract it, And the Rabbis say: He cannot retract
llm_translation: He was obligated to his fellow with an oath, and he said to him: "Dor li in your life." Rabbi Meir says: He can retract, and the Sages say: He cannot retract.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַב דִּימִי בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יוֹסֵף: כְּגוֹן דְּקַבְּלֵיהּ עֲלֵיהּ בְּחַד.
human_translation: Rav Dimi, son of Rav Naḥman, son of Rav Yosef, says: where accepted upon himself as one
llm_translation: Gemara: Rav Dimi, son of Rav Nachman, son of Rav Yosef, said: For example, when he received it on one.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: מַחְלוֹקֶת בְּ״מָחוּל לָךְ״, אֲבָל בְּ״אֶתֵּן לָךְ״ – דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל יָכוֹל לַחְזוֹר בּוֹ. וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: בְּ״אֶתֵּן לָךְ״ – מַחְלוֹקֶת.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: dispute with regard to forgiven you But in I will give you everyone agrees he can retract And Rabbi Yoḥanan says: dispute with regard to I will give you
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: Disagreement in "machul lach," but in "eten lach" - everyone can retract. And Rabbi Yochanan said: In "eten lach" - disagreement.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: בְּ״אֶתֵּן לָךְ״ – מַחְלוֹקֶת, אֲבָל בְּ״מָחוּל לָךְ״ – דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל אֵין יָכוֹל לַחְזוֹר בּוֹ? אוֹ דִילְמָא: בֵּין בָּזוֹ וּבֵין בָּזוֹ מַחְלוֹקֶת?
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before dispute with regard to I will give you, but in forgiven you, everyone agrees he cannot retract Or perhaps dispute is both with regard to this and with regard to that
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: He asked them: regarding "I will give you" - a dispute, but regarding "I will dance for you" - everyone agrees that one cannot retract? Or perhaps: is there a dispute both in this case and in that case?

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּאָמַר רָבָא: מַחְלוֹקֶת בְּ״אֶתֵּן לָךְ״, אֲבָל בְּ״מָחוּל לָךְ״ – דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל אֵין יָכוֹל לַחְזוֹר בּוֹ.
human_translation: Come hear which Rava says: dispute is with regard to I will give you, but in forgiven you, everyone agrees he cannot retract
llm_translation: Come and hear, for Rava said: The dispute regarding "I give it to you" is one thing, but regarding "I relinquish it to you" - everyone agrees that one cannot retract.

hebrew_text: אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא בְּ״אֶתֵּן לָךְ״ – מַחְלוֹקֶת, אֲבָל בְּ״מָחוּל לָךְ״ – דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל אֵין יָכוֹל לַחְזוֹר בּוֹ, רָבָא דְּאָמַר כְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן. אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ בֵּין בָּזוֹ וּבֵין בָּזוֹ מַחְלוֹקֶת, רָבָא דְּאָמַר כְּמַאן?
human_translation: Granted, if you say dispute with regard to I will give you, but in forgiven you, everyone agrees he cannot retract Rava is stating in accordance with Rabbi Yoḥanan. But if you say dispute is both with regard to this and with regard to that in accordance with whose is Rava stating
llm_translation: Talmudic text: If you say "with 'I will give you'" - there is a dispute, but with "I will dance for you" - everyone agrees that one cannot retract, Rava said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan. Rather, if you say there is a dispute both ways, Rava said, like whom? English translation:

hebrew_text: רָבָא טַעְמָא דְנַפְשֵׁיהּ קָאָמַר.
human_translation: Rava is stating his own explanation
llm_translation: Rava ta'ama d'nafshei ka'amar.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רַב אַחָא בַּר תַּחְלִיפָא לְרָבָא: הָיָה חַיָּיב לַחֲבֵירוֹ שְׁבוּעָה, וְאָמַר לוֹ: ״דּוֹר לִי בְּחַיֵּי רֹאשֶׁךָ״. רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: יָכוֹל לַחְזוֹר בּוֹ, וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֵין יָכוֹל לַחְזוֹר בּוֹ.
human_translation: Rav Aḥa bar Taḥlifa raised an objection to Rava was obligated an oath to another, and said to him: Vow to me by the life of your head Rabbi Meir says: can retract it; and the Rabbis say: He cannot retract
llm_translation: He raised an objection to Rav Ahah bar Tahalifa against Rava: If he was obligated to his fellow a vow, and he said to him: "Dwell with me in your life," Rabbi Meir says: He can retract, and the Sages say: He cannot retract.

hebrew_text: מַאי לָאו בְּאוֹתָן הַנִּשְׁבָּעִין וְלֹא מְשַׁלְּמִין, דַּהֲוָה לֵיהּ כְּ״מָחוּל לָךְ״?
human_translation: What, not to those who take an oath and do not pay, which is the same as is forgiven you.
llm_translation: What is the reason why they do not pay those who take an oath and do not fulfill it, as it would be to him like "wiping you away"?

hebrew_text: לָא, בְּאוֹתָן הַנִּשְׁבָּעִין וְנוֹטְלִין, דְּהָוֵה לֵיהּ כְּ״אֶתֵּן לָךְ״.
human_translation: No, to those who take an oath and collect it is the same as I will give you
llm_translation: Not in those who swear and take, for it is like "I will give you."

hebrew_text: וְהָא תְּנָא לֵיהּ רֵישָׁא!
human_translation: But taught the first clause,
llm_translation: And there is a Tanna who teaches the beginning!

hebrew_text: תְּנָא תּוֹלֶה בְּדַעַת אֲחֵרִים, וּתְנָא תּוֹלֶה בְּדַעַת עַצְמוֹ.
human_translation: taught makes dependent on the decision of others, and taught he makes dependent on own decision.
llm_translation: A Tanna hangs on the opinion of others, and a Tanna hangs on his own opinion.

hebrew_text: וּצְרִיכָא, דְּאִי תְּנָא תּוֹלֶה בְּדַעַת אֲחֵרִים – בְּהָא קָאָמַר רַבִּי מֵאִיר דְּמָצֵי הָדַר בֵּיהּ, מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא גָּמַר וּמַקְנֵי, דְּאָמַר: ״מִי יֵימַר דִּמְזַכֵּי לֵיהּ?״ אֲבָל תּוֹלֶה בְּדַעַת עַצְמוֹ, אֵימָא מוֹדֵי לְהוּ לְרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: And it is necessary since if taught he makes dependent on the decision of others, in this Rabbi Meir says that he can retract because he did not resolve to transfer as he said Who will say that will rule in favor of But he makes dependent on own decision say concedes to the Rabbis
llm_translation: The matter requires, for if one teaches relying on the opinion of others - in this case Rabbi Meir is saying that he finds it fitting, because he did not complete and acquire it, as he said: "Who can say that he merits it?" But if one relies on his own opinion, one should say that the Sages agree with him.

hebrew_text: וְאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן בְּהָא, בְּהָא קָאָמְרִי רַבָּנַן, אֲבָל בְּהַהִיא אֵימָא מוֹדוּ לֵיהּ רַבָּנַן לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר. צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: And if would teach us this in this the Rabbis say but in that say the Rabbis concede to Rabbi Meir it is necessary
llm_translation: And if we would hear in this one, in this one the Rabbis are saying, but in that one why not say the Rabbis concede to Rabbi Meir. This is necessary.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: מַחְלוֹקֶת לִפְנֵי גְּמַר דִּין, אֲבָל לְאַחַר גְּמַר דִּין – דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל אֵין יָכוֹל לַחְזוֹר בּוֹ. וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: לְאַחַר גְּמַר דִּין מַחְלוֹקֶת.
human_translation: Reish Lakish says: dispute before the verdict But after the verdict everyone agrees one cannot retract And Rabbi Yoḥanan says: dispute after the verdict
llm_translation: Reish Lakish said: A dispute before the final judgment, but after the final judgment - everyone agrees that one cannot retract. And Rabbi Yochanan said: After the final judgment there is a dispute.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: לְאַחַר גְּמַר דִּין מַחְלוֹקֶת, אֲבָל לִפְנֵי גְּמַר דִּין דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל יָכוֹל לַחְזוֹר בּוֹ? אוֹ דִילְמָא: בֵּין בָּזוֹ וּבֵין בָּזוֹ מַחְלוֹקֶת?
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before dispute after the verdict but before the verdict everyone agrees he can retract Or perhaps dispute is both with regard to this and with regard to that
llm_translation: He asked them: After the conclusion of a dispute, but before the conclusion of a judgment, is everyone able to retract? Or perhaps, is there a dispute both ways?

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּאָמַר רָבָא: קִיבֵּל עָלָיו קָרוֹב אוֹ פָּסוּל – לִפְנֵי גְּמַר דִּין יָכוֹל לַחְזוֹר בּוֹ, לְאַחַר גְּמַר דִּין אֵין יָכוֹל לַחְזוֹר בּוֹ.
human_translation: Come hear as Rava says: accepted a relative upon himself or one who is disqualified he can retract before the verdict He cannot retract after the verdict
llm_translation: Come and hear, for Rava said: If a close relative or an ineligible person accepted a ruling upon himself - before the final judgment he can retract, after the final judgment he cannot retract.

hebrew_text: אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא: לְאַחַר גְּמַר דִּין מַחְלוֹקֶת, אֲבָל לִפְנֵי גְּמַר דִּין דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל יָכוֹל לַחְזוֹר בּוֹ – רָבָא דְּאָמַר כְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן וְאַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבָּנַן. אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ: בֵּין בָּזוֹ בֵּין בָּזוֹ מַחְלוֹקֶת – רָבָא דְּאָמַר כְּמַאן?
human_translation: Granted, if you say dispute after the verdict but before the verdict everyone agrees one can retract Rava is stating in accordance with Rabbi Yoḥanan, and according to of the Rabbis. But if you say dispute is both with regard to this and with regard to that in accordance with whose is Rava stating
llm_translation: If you say: After the completion of the judgment of the dispute, but before the completion of the judgment, everyone can retract - Rava said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan and according to the opinion of the Rabbis. Rather, if you say: Whether in this case or in that case there is a dispute - Rava said, according to whose opinion?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, לָאו שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: לְאַחַר גְּמַר דִּין מַחְלוֹקֶת? שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Rather, not conclude from dispute after the verdict Conclude from
llm_translation: Rather, it is not a conclusive proof: after the completion of the judgment, is there still a dispute? Conclusive proof.

hebrew_text: שְׁלַח לֵיהּ רַב נַחְמָן בַּר רַב חִסְדָּא לְרַב נַחְמָן בַּר יַעֲקֹב: יְלַמְּדֵנוּ רַבֵּינוּ, לִפְנֵי גְּמַר דִּין מַחְלוֹקֶת אוֹ לְאַחַר גְּמַר דִּין מַחְלוֹקֶת? וַהֲלָכָה כְּדִבְרֵי מִי? שְׁלַח לֵיהּ: לְאַחַר גְּמַר דִּין מַחְלוֹקֶת, וַהֲלָכָה כְּדִבְרֵי חֲכָמִים.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman, son of Rav Ḥisda, sent to Rav Naḥman bar Ya’akov: Our teacher, instruct us: dispute before the verdict or dispute after the verdict And in accordance with whose statement the halakha ? sent to him dispute after the verdict and the halakha in accordance with the statement of the Rabbis.
llm_translation: Send to him Rav Nachman bar Rav Chisda to Rav Nachman bar Yaakov: Should our teacher teach us, before the conclusion of a dispute or after the conclusion of a dispute? And the halacha according to whose words? Send to him: After the conclusion of a dispute, and the halacha according to the words of the sages.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: הָכִי שְׁלַח לֵיהּ, בְּ״אֶתֵּן לָךְ״ מַחְלוֹקֶת, אוֹ בְּ״מָחוּל לָךְ״ מַחְלוֹקֶת? וַהֲלָכָה כְּדִבְרֵי מִי? שְׁלַח לֵיהּ: בְּ״אֶתֵּן לָךְ״ מַחְלוֹקֶת, וַהֲלָכָה כְּדִבְרֵי חֲכָמִים.
human_translation: Rav Ashi says This sent to dispute with regard to I will give you, or dispute with regard to forgiven you? And in accordance with whose statement the halakha ? sent to him: dispute is with regard to I will give you, and the halakha in accordance with the statement of the Rabbis.
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: Thus he sent to him, with "I give to you" a dispute, or with "I forgive you" a dispute? And the halakha is according to whose words? He sent to him: with "I give to you" a dispute, and the halakha is according to the words of the sages.

hebrew_text: בְּסוּרָא מַתְנוּ הָכִי. בְּפוּמְבְּדִיתָא מַתְנוּ הָכִי, אָמַר רַב חֲנִינָא בַּר שֶׁלֶמְיָה: שְׁלַחוּ לֵיהּ מִבֵּי רַב לִשְׁמוּאֵל, יְלַמְּדֵנוּ רַבֵּינוּ: לִפְנֵי גְּמַר דִּין וְקָנוּ מִיָּדוֹ, מַאי? שְׁלַח לְהוּ: אֵין לְאַחַר קִנְיָין כְּלוּם.
human_translation: In Sura they teach that In Pumbedita they teach this Rav Ḥanina bar Shelemya says they sent from Rav’s study hall to Shmuel: Our teacher, instruct us: before the verdict and had performed act of acquisition with him what sent them Nothing after an act of acquisition
llm_translation: In Sura they taught thus. In Pumbedita they taught thus. Rav Hanina bar Shelamyah said: They sent to him from the house of Rav to Shmuel, let our master teach us: Before he completes the judgment and acquires it immediately, what? Send to them: There is nothing after acquisition.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ וְאֵלּוּ הֵן הַפְּסוּלִין: הַמְשַׂחֵק בְּקוּבְיָא, וְהַמַּלְוֶה בְּרִיבִּית, וּמַפְרִיחֵי יוֹנִים, וְסוֹחֲרֵי שְׁבִיעִית.
human_translation: And these are the ones disqualified One who plays with dice [ bekubbiyya ] and one who lends with interest, and those who fly pigeons, and merchants of the Sabbatical
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: And these are the disqualified ones: one who plays with dice, and one who lends with interest, and those who release doves, and traders of the Sabbatical year.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: בַּתְּחִילָּה הָיוּ קוֹרִין אוֹתָן אוֹסְפֵי שְׁבִיעִית. מִשֶּׁרַבּוּ הָאַנָּסִין, חָזְרוּ לִקְרוֹתָן סוֹחֲרֵי שְׁבִיעִית.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon said: Initially, would call them: Gatherers of the Sabbatical Once the tax collectors grew abundant they would then call them: Merchants of the Sabbatical
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon said: Initially, they would read them, the collectors of the seventh year produce. Once the tax collectors increased, the merchants of the seventh year produce resumed reading them.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: אֵימָתַי? בִּזְמַן שֶׁאֵין לָהֶן אוּמָּנוּת אֶלָּא הוּא, אֲבָל יֵשׁ לָהֶן אוּמָּנוּת שֶׁלֹּא הוּא – כְּשֵׁרִין.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda said: When when they have no occupation but this one. But they have an occupation other than this one, they are fit
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda said: When? At a time when they have no skill except for him, but if they have a skill other than him - they are valid.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מְשַׂחֵק בְּקוּבְיָא, מַאי קָא עָבֵיד? אָמַר רָמֵי בַּר חָמָא: מִשּׁוּם דְּהָוֵה אַסְמַכְתָּא, וְאַסְמַכְתָּא לָא קָנְיָא.
human_translation: one who plays with dice what is he doing Rami bar Ḥama says: because is a transaction with inconclusive consent [ asmakhta ], And an asmakhta does not effect acquisition,
llm_translation: Gemar (Talmudic student) is playing with a kubya (a type of dice cup), what is he doing? Ramei bar Ḥama said: Because it is a support, and a support does not acquire.

hebrew_text: רַב שֵׁשֶׁת אָמַר: כֹּל כִּי הַאי גַוְונָא לָאו אַסְמַכְתָּא הִיא, אֶלָּא לְפִי שֶׁאֵין עֲסוּקִין בְּיִישּׁוּבוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם.
human_translation: Rav Sheshet says: Any case like this is not an asmakhta . Rather, because they are not involved in settling the world,
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet said: All when this case not a support it is, rather because not engaged in the settlement of the world.

hebrew_text: מַאי בֵּינַיְיהוּ? אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ דִּגְמַר אוּמָּנוּתָא אַחֲרִיתִי.
human_translation: What between between them where learns another occupation,
llm_translation: What is the difference between them? There is a difference between them in that he completed the final craftsmanship.

hebrew_text: וּתְנַן, אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: אֵימָתַי? בִּזְמַן שֶׁאֵין לָהֶן אוּמָּנוּת אֶלָּא הוּא; אֲבָל יֵשׁ לָהֶן אוּמָּנוּת שֶׁלֹּא הוּא – הֲרֵי זֶה כְּשֵׁרִים. אַלְמָא, טַעְמָא דְמַתְנִיתִין מִשּׁוּם יִישּׁוּבוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם הוּא. קַשְׁיָא לְרָמֵי בַּר חָמָא!
human_translation: But we learned Rabbi Yehuda said: When when they have no occupation but this one. But they have an occupation other than this one they are fit Apparently, the reason that the mishna is that settling the world, a difficulty to Rami bar Ḥama.
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: Rabbi Yehuda said: When is this? When they have no skill except that; but if they have a skill other than that - they are valid. This implies that the reason of the Mishnah is because it is a permanent occupation. This is difficult for Ramei bar Chama to answer!

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא: פְּלִיגִי רַבָּנַן עֲלֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה? וְהָא אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה
human_translation: And if you would say the Rabbis disagree with Rabbi Yehuda, But doesn’t Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi say: Any place where Rabbi Yehuda says
llm_translation: And if you will say: Do the Rabbis disagree with Rabbi Yehuda? But Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: Any place where Rabbi Yehuda said

hebrew_text: ״אֵימָתַי״ וּ״בַמֶּה״ אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא לְפָרֵשׁ דִּבְרֵי חֲכָמִים.
human_translation: When or: In what only to explain the statement of the Rabbis,
llm_translation: "When" and "with what" is only to explain the words of the sages.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: ״אֵימָתַי״ – לְפָרֵשׁ, וּ״בַמֶּה״ – לַחְלוֹק. וּדְכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא ״אֵימָתַי״ לְפָרֵשׁ הוּא.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says When to explain but In what to disagree. But to everyone, when to explain
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: "When" - to explain, and "with what" - to differentiate. And the principle of the world is that "when" is for explanation.

hebrew_text: גַּבְרָא אַגַּבְרָא קָא רָמֵית? מָר סָבַר: פְּלִיגִי, וּמָר סָבַר: לָא פְּלִיגִי.
human_translation: Are you setting man against man? Sage, holds disagree and Sage, holds they do not disagree.
llm_translation: A man against a man are you raising? Master holds: they argue, and Master holds: they do not argue.

hebrew_text: וְלָא פְּלִיגִי? וְהָתַנְיָא: בֵּין שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ אוּמָּנוּת שֶׁלֹּא הוּא, בֵּין שֶׁאֵין לוֹ אוּמָּנוּת אֶלָּא הוּא – הֲרֵי זֶה פָּסוּל.
human_translation: And do they not disagree? But isn’t it taught Whether has an occupation other than this one, whether he does not have an occupation other than this one, he is disqualified
llm_translation: And did they not dispute? But it was taught in a Baraita: Whether he has a skill or not, whether he has no skill except for himself - this one is disqualified.

hebrew_text: הָהִיא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן הִיא, דְּתַנְיָא: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן, לְעוֹלָם אֵין אֶחָד מֵהֶן נָזִיר, לְפִי שֶׁלֹּא נִתְּנָה נְזִירוּת אֶלָּא לְהַפְלָאָה.
human_translation: That it is Rabbi Yehuda in the name of Rabbi Tarfon. As it is taught Rabbi Yehuda says in the name of Rabbi Tarfon: actually, neither of them a nazirite, as naziriteship is determined only by explicitness.
llm_translation: That one, Rabbi Yehuda in the name of Rabbi Tarfon, she is, as it was taught: Rabbi Yehuda says in the name of Rabbi Tarfon, "Always, neither of them is a Nazir, for Naziriteship was given only for wonder."

hebrew_text: מַלְוֶה בְּרִבִּית. אָמַר רָבָא: לָוָה בְּרִבִּית – פָּסוּל לְעֵדוּת. וְהָאֲנַן תְּנַן: מַלְוֶה בְּרִבִּית? מִלְוָה הַבָּאָה בְּרִבִּית.
human_translation: one who lends with interest Rava says: One who borrows with interest is disqualified from bearing witness. But didn’t we learn one who lends with interest a loan that comes with interest,
llm_translation: Borrowing with interest. Rava said: One who borrows with interest - disqualified for testimony. But we learned: Borrowing with interest? Refers to a loan that comes with interest.

hebrew_text: בַּר בִּינִיתּוֹס אַסְהִידוּ בֵּיהּ תְּרֵי סָהֲדֵי. חַד אָמַר: קַמֵּי דִּידִי אוֹזֵיף בְּרִיבִּיתָא, וְחַד אָמַר: לְדִידִי אוֹזְפַן בְּרִיבִּיתָא. פַּסְלֵיהּ רָבָא לְבַר בִּינִיתּוֹס.
