human_translation: Two witnesses testified about bar Binittos. One said: He lent with interest in my presence, and one said: He lent me with interest. Rava rendered bar Binittos disqualified
llm_translation: Son of Binitos testified against him two witnesses. One said: "Before me I will add interest," and one said: "Before me I will not add interest." Rava invalidated the document of Bar Binitos.

hebrew_text: וְהָא רָבָא הוּא דְּאָמַר: לָוָה בְּרִבִּית פָּסוּל לְעֵדוּת, וְהָוֵה לֵיהּ רָשָׁע, וְהַתּוֹרָה אָמְרָה: ״אַל תָּשֶׁת רָשָׁע עֵד״.
human_translation: But isn’t Rava the one who said one who borrows with interest is disqualified from bearing witness? And is considered a wicked man, and the Torah states: Do not place a wicked man as a witness
llm_translation: And Rava is the one who said: One who lends with interest is disqualified as a witness, and he becomes wicked, and the Torah said: "Do not place a wicked person as a witness."

hebrew_text: רָבָא לְטַעְמֵיהּ, דְּאָמַר רָבָא: אָדָם קָרוֹב אֵצֶל עַצְמוֹ, וְאֵין אָדָם מֵשִׂים עַצְמוֹ רָשָׁע.
human_translation: Rava to his reasoning, as Rava says: A person is his own relative and a person cannot make himself wicked.
llm_translation: Rava according to his reasoning, for Rava said: A person is close to himself, and a person does not consider himself wicked.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא טַבָּחָא דְּאִישְׁתְּכַח דִּנְפַקָא טְרֵיפְתָּא מִתּוּתֵי יְדֵיהּ, פַּסְלֵיהּ רַב נַחְמָן וְעַבְּרֵיהּ. אֲזַל רַבִּי מַזְיֵהּ וְטוּפְרֵיהּ. סְבַר רַב נַחְמָן לְאַכְשׁוֹרֵיהּ.
human_translation: a certain slaughterer about whom it was discovered that an animal with a wound that would have caused it to die within twelve months, emerged from his possession. Rav Naḥman disqualified him and removed him went grew his fingernails and his hair Rav Naḥman thought to deem him fit
llm_translation: That butcher who found a treifah among his utensils, Rav Nachman declared it invalid and prohibited. Rabbi Mazye went and overturned it. Rav Nachman thought to protest against him.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא: דִּילְמָא אִיעָרוֹמֵי קָא מַעֲרֵים?
human_translation: Rava said to Perhaps he is employing artifice,
llm_translation: Rava said to him: Perhaps he is raising objections?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מַאי תַּקַּנְתֵּיהּ? כִּדְרַב אִידִי בַּר אָבִין, דְּאָמַר רַב אִידִי בַּר אָבִין: הֶחָשׁוּד עַל הַטְּרֵיפוֹת אֵין לוֹ תַּקָּנָה עַד שֶׁיֵּלֵךְ לְמָקוֹם שֶׁאֵין מַכִּירִין אוֹתוֹ וְיַחְזִיר אֲבֵידָה בְּדָבָר חָשׁוּב, אוֹ שֶׁיּוֹצִיא טְרֵיפָה מִתַּחַת יָדוֹ בְּדָבָר חָשׁוּב מִשֶּׁלּוֹ.
human_translation: Rather, what is his remedy? in accordance with of Rav Idi bar Avin; as Rav Idi bar Avin says: One who is suspected of tereifot has no remedy until he goes to a locale where do not recognize him and returns a lost item of substantial value or removes his own tereifa of significant value from his possession.
llm_translation: Rather, what is its remedy? Like Rav Idi bar Avin said, as Rav Idi bar Avin said: One suspected of feeding animals with trefah has no remedy until he goes to a place where he is not recognized and returns a lost item in a significant matter, or he removes the trefah from under his hand in a significant matter of his own.

hebrew_text: וּמַפְרִיחֵי יוֹנִים, מַאי מַפְרִיחֵי יוֹנִים? הָכָא תַּרְגִּימוּ: ״אִי תִּקְדְּמֵיהּ יוֹנָךְ לְיוֹן״. רַבִּי חָמָא בַּר אוֹשַׁעְיָא אָמַר: ״אָרָא״.
human_translation: And those who fly pigeons. What Those who fly pigeons? Here, explained If your pigeon reaches before my pigeon Rabbi Ḥama bar Oshaya says: an ara ,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And those who cause doves to flourish, what is 'those who cause doves to flourish'? Here they interpreted: 'If your dove precedes the lion.' Rabbi Ḥama bar Oshaya said: 'I will see.'" English translation: "And those who cause doves to flourish, what is 'those who cause doves to flourish'? Here they interpreted: 'If your dove precedes the lion.' Rabbi Ḥama bar Oshaya said: 'I will see.'"

hebrew_text: מַאן דְּאָמַר: ״אִי תִּקְדְּמֵיהּ יוֹנָךְ לְיוֹן״, מַאי טַעְמָא לָא אָמַר ״אָרָא״?
human_translation: the one who says If your pigeon reaches before my pigeon what is the reason he does not say an ara ?
llm_translation: The one who says: "If your dove precedes the lion," what is the reason he did not say "I will see"?

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָךְ: ״אָרָא״ – מִפְּנֵי דַּרְכֵי שָׁלוֹם בְּעָלְמָא.
human_translation: say to you an ara merely due to the ways of peace.
llm_translation: He said to you: "I will see" - because of the ways of peace in the world.

hebrew_text: וּמַאן דְּאָמַר ״אָרָא״, מַאי טַעְמָא לָא אָמַר: ״אִי תִּקְדְּמֵיהּ יוֹנָךְ לְיוֹן״? אָמַר לָךְ: הַיְינוּ מְשַׂחֵק בְּקוּבְיָא.
human_translation: And the one who says an ara , what is the reason he does not say If your pigeon reaches before my pigeon say to you is plays with dice;
llm_translation: And one who says "I will see," what is the reason he did not say, "If your dove precedes the lion?" I say to you: That is playing with a lion.

hebrew_text: וְאִידַּךְ?
human_translation: And the other
llm_translation: And the other side?

hebrew_text: תְּנָא תּוֹלֶה בְּדַעַת עַצְמוֹ, וּתְנָא תּוֹלֶה בְּדַעַת יוֹנוֹ.
human_translation: taught making it dependent on his own decision, and taught making it dependent on the decision of his pigeon,
llm_translation: A Tanna hangs by his own knowledge, and a Tanna hangs by the knowledge of his teacher.

hebrew_text: וּצְרִיכָא, דְּאִי תְּנָא תּוֹלֶה בְּדַעַת עַצְמוֹ – הָתָם הוּא דְּלָא גָּמַר וּמַקְנֵי, דְּאָמַר:
human_translation: And necessary. As had taught making it dependent on his own decision, it is there that he does not resolve to transfer as he says
llm_translation: The matter requires, for if one teaches relying on his own understanding - there, he has not completed and acquired, as it says:

hebrew_text: קִים לִי בְּנַפְשַׁאי דְּיָדַעְנָא טְפֵי. אֲבָל תּוֹלֶה בְּדַעַת יוֹנוֹ – אֵימָא לָא.
human_translation: I am certain of myself that I know better But makes it dependent on the decision of his pigeon, say not
llm_translation: "I establish for myself with my own soul that I know a little. But one who relies on the knowledge of his dove - I will say no."

hebrew_text: וְאִי תְּנָא תּוֹלֶה בְּדַעַת יוֹנוֹ, דְּאָמַר: בְּנַקָּשָׁא תַּלְיָא מִילְּתָא, וַאֲנָא יָדַעְנָא לְנַקּוֹשֵׁי טְפֵי. אֲבָל תּוֹלֶה בְּדַעַת עַצְמוֹ – אֵימָא לָא. צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: And had taught makes it dependent on the decision of his pigeon, as he says: The matter, is determined by knocking and I know to knock better But makes it dependent on his own decision, say not necessary
llm_translation: "If you say that one relies on the opinion of his dove, for it is said: 'On a difficult matter hang a question,' and I know how to resolve difficult questions. But if one relies on his own opinion - I say, no. This is necessary."

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: הַמְשַׂחֵק בְּקוּבְיָא – אֵלּוּ הֵן הַמְשַׂחֲקִים בִּפְסֵיפָסִים. וְלֹא בִּפְסֵיפָסִים בִּלְבַד אָמְרוּ, אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ קְלִיפֵּי אֱגוֹזִים וּקְלִיפֵּי רִימּוֹנִים.
human_translation: raises an objection one who plays with dice, these are ones who play with pispasim , But did not say only with pispasim rather even nutshells or pomegranate shells
llm_translation: Challenger: One who plays with kuvya - these are the ones who play with tesserae. And not only with tesserae did they say, but even with walnut shells and pomegranate shells.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָתַי חֲזָרָתָן? מִשֶּׁיְּשַׁבְּרוּ אֶת פְּסֵיפָסֵיהֶן וְיַחְזְרוּ בָּהֶן חֲזָרָה גְּמוּרָה, דַּאֲפִילּוּ בְּחִנָּם לָא עָבְדִי.
human_translation: And when is their repentance Once they break their pispasim and repent of them completely, where they do not do even for nothing,
llm_translation: And when is their repetition? When they break their pieces and repeat a complete repetition in them, for even without payment they do not perform.

hebrew_text: מַלְוֶה בְּרִיבִּית: אֶחָד הַמַּלְוֶה וְאֶחָד הַלֹּוֶה. וְאֵימָתַי חֲזָרָתָן? מִשֶּׁיְּקָרְעוּ אֶת שְׁטָרֵיהֶן, וְיַחְזְרוּ בָּהֶן חֲזָרָה גְּמוּרָה, דַּאֲפִילּוּ לְגוֹי לָא מוֹזְפִי.
human_translation: One who lends with interest, both the lender and the borrower. And when is their repentance Once they tear their notes and repent of them completely, they do not lend even to a gentile.
llm_translation: Lending with interest: one who lends and one who borrows. And when do they retract? When they tear up their documents, and they retract with a complete retraction, for even to a non-Jew one should not be deceptive.

hebrew_text: וּמַפְרִיחֵי יוֹנִים – אֵלּוּ שֶׁמַּמְרִין אֶת הַיּוֹנִים. וְלֹא יוֹנִים בִּלְבַד אָמְרוּ, אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ בְּהֵמָה חַיָּה וָעוֹף. וְאֵימָתַי חֲזָרָתָן? מִשֶּׁיְּשַׁבְּרוּ אֶת פְּגָמֵיהֶן, וְיַחְזְרוּ בָּהֶן חֲזָרָה גְּמוּרָה, דַּאֲפִילּוּ בַּמִּדְבָּר נָמֵי לָא עָבְדִי.
human_translation: And who fly pigeons, those who induce the pigeons And did not say only pigeons rather, even a domesticated animal, an undomesticated animal, or bird And when is their repentance Once they break their fixtures [ pigmeihen ] and repent completely, where they do not do even in the wilderness,
llm_translation: "and those who cause doves to multiply" - these are those who cause the doves to become barren. And not only doves did they say, but even with regard to a living animal or bird. And when is their return? Once they have broken their defects, and they return to them completely, for even in the wilderness they did not do so."

hebrew_text: סוֹחֲרֵי שְׁבִיעִית – אֵלּוּ שֶׁנּוֹשְׂאִין וְנוֹתְנִין בְּפֵירוֹת שְׁבִיעִית. וְאֵימָתַי חֲזָרָתָן? מִשֶּׁתַּגִּיעַ שְׁבִיעִית אַחֶרֶת וְיִבָּדְלוּ.
human_translation: Merchants of the Sabbatical those who do business with produce of the Sabbatical And when is their repentance Once another Sabbatical occurs and they refrain
llm_translation: Traders of the Sabbatical Year - these are the ones who engage in buying and selling with the produce of the Sabbatical Year. And when do they return? Once the next Sabbatical Year arrives and they are separated.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה: לֹא חֲזָרַת דְּבָרִים בִּלְבַד אָמְרוּ, אֶלָּא חֲזָרַת מָמוֹן. כֵּיצַד? אוֹמֵר: אֲנִי פְּלוֹנִי בַּר פְּלוֹנִי, כִּינַּסְתִּי מָאתַיִם זוּז בְּפֵירוֹת שְׁבִיעִית, וַהֲרֵי הֵן נְתוּנִין בְּמַתָּנָה לַעֲנִיִּים.
human_translation: And Rabbi Neḥemya said: did not say verbal repentance alone rather, returning money How He says: I, so-and-so the son of so-and-so, gathered, two hundred dinars in produce of the Sabbatical and hereby given as a gift to the poor.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Nechemiah said: They did not only say to review words, but to review money. How so? One says: I, so-and-so son of so-and-so, have collected two hundred zuz in seventh-year produce, and behold, they are designated as a gift to the poor.

hebrew_text: קָתָנֵי מִיהַת: בְּהֵמָה. בִּשְׁלָמָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר ״אִי תִּקְדְּמֵיהּ יוֹנָךְ לְיוֹן״, הַיְינוּ דְּמַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ בְּהֵמָה. אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר ״אָרָא״, בְּהֵמָה בַּת הָכִי הִיא?
human_translation: In any event, it is taught a domesticated animal Granted, according to the one who says If your pigeon reaches before my pigeon this is how you find a domesticated animal But according to the one who says an ara , is a domesticated animal capable of
llm_translation: It was taught in one place: regarding an animal. Granted according to the one who says, "If your bird goes before you to the lion," that means you find it with an animal. But according to the one who says, "I will see," is an animal the daughter of a lioness?

hebrew_text: אִין, בְּשׁוֹר הַבָּר, וּכְמַאן דְּאָמַר שׁוֹר הַבָּר מִין בְּהֵמָה הוּא, דִּתְנַן: שׁוֹר הַבָּר מִין בְּהֵמָה הוּא. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: מִין חַיָּה.
human_translation: Yes, with regard to the wild ox, And according to the one who says the wild ox is a species of domesticated animal, as we learned The wild ox is a species of domesticated animal. Rabbi Yosei says: a species of undomesticated animal.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Ein, b'shor habar, u'k'man de'amar shor habar min b'hemah hu, di'tnan: shor habar min b'hemah hu. Rabbi Yosei omer: min chayah." English translation: "No, in the wild ox, and according to the one who says the wild ox is a species of animal, as we learned: the wild ox is a species of animal. Rabbi Yosei says: a species of wild animal."

hebrew_text: תָּנָא: הוֹסִיפוּ עֲלֵיהֶן הַגַּזְלָנִין וְהַחַמְסָנִין.
human_translation: taught added the robbers and those who force transactions, to
llm_translation: It was taught: The robbers and the extortioners added to them.

hebrew_text: גַּזְלָן? דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא הוּא! לֹא נִצְרְכָא אֶלָּא לִמְצִיאַת חֵרֵשׁ, שׁוֹטֶה, וְקָטָן.
human_translation: A robber is by Torah law; is necessary only to an item found by a deaf-mute, an imbecile, or a minor,
llm_translation: "Gazlan? It is of biblical origin! It is only necessary for the discovery of a deaf-mute, an imbecile, and a minor."

hebrew_text: מֵעִיקָּרָא סְבוּר: מְצִיאַת חֵרֵשׁ, שׁוֹטֶה, וְקָטָן לָא שְׁכִיחָא. אִי נָמֵי, מִפְּנֵי דַּרְכֵי שָׁלוֹם בְּעָלְמָא. כֵּיוָן דַּחֲזוֹ דְּסוֹף סוֹף מָמוֹנָא הוּא דְּקָא שָׁקְלִי, פַּסְלִינְהוּ רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: initially assumed an item found by a deaf-mute, an imbecile, or a minor is uncommon. Alternatively, merely on account of the ways of peace, When they realized that ultimately were taking property the Sages disqualified them.
llm_translation: From the outset, he thought: Finding a deaf-mute, a fool, and a minor is not common. Indeed, because of the ways of peace in the world. Once they saw that ultimately it is a matter of money that he is taking, the Rabbis invalidated them.

hebrew_text: הַחַמְסָנִין, מֵעִיקָּרָא סְבוּר דְּמֵי קָא יָהֵיב (אַקְרַאי בְּעָלְמָא הוּא). כֵּיוָן דַּחֲזוֹ דְּקָא חָטְפִי, גְּזַרוּ בְּהוּ רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: those who force transactions, initially they assumed They would pay money was merely occasional; When they realized that were snatching the Sages issued a decree that they
llm_translation: The ḥamsanin, from the outset thought that he was giving money (it is a mere coincidence). Once they saw that he was deceiving, the Rabbis decreed against them.

hebrew_text: תָּנָא: עוֹד הוֹסִיפוּ עֲלֵיהֶן הָרוֹעִים, הַגַּבָּאִין, וְהַמּוֹכְסִין.
human_translation: taught further added to The shepherds, the collectors and the customs officials,
llm_translation: Mishnah: The shepherds, the tax collectors, and the money changers added to them.

hebrew_text: רוֹעִים, מֵעִיקָּרָא סְבוּר אַקְרַאי בְּעָלְמָא הוּא. כֵּיוָן דַּחֲזוֹ דְּקָא מְכַוְּונִי וְשָׁדוּ לְכַתְּחִילָּה, גְּזַרוּ בְּהוּ רַבָּנַן. הַגַּבָּאִין וְהַמּוֹכְסִין, מֵעִיקָּרָא סְבוּר מַאי דְּקִיץ לְהוּ קָא שָׁקְלִי. כֵּיוָן דַּחֲזוֹ דְּקָא שָׁקְלִי יַתִּירָא, פַּסְלִינְהוּ.
human_translation: Shepherds initially assumed it was merely incidental When they realized that they would intentionally send from the outset, the Sages issued a decree that they The collectors and the customs officials initially assumed they would take the set amount they When they realized that were taking more they disqualified them.
llm_translation: Shepherds, initially thought to be mere passersby. Once they were seen to be directing and leading the way, the Rabbis decreed concerning them. The tax collectors and the assessors, initially thought that they were taking what was rightfully theirs. Once they were seen to be taking more than they should, they were disqualified.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: רוֹעֶה שֶׁאָמְרוּ, אֶחָד רוֹעֵה בְּהֵמָה דַּקָּה וְאֶחָד רוֹעֵה בְּהֵמָה גַּסָּה.
human_translation: Rava says: shepherd that said both a shepherd of small livestock and a herder of large livestock.
llm_translation: Rava said: "A shepherd who they said, one shepherds a small animal and one shepherds a large animal."

hebrew_text: וּמִי אָמַר רָבָא הָכִי? וְהָאָמַר רָבָא: רוֹעֵה בְּהֵמָה דַּקָּה בְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל – פְּסוּלִין, בְּחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ – כְּשֵׁרִין. רוֹעֵה בְּהֵמָה גַּסָּה, אֲפִילּוּ בְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל – כְּשֵׁרִין. הָהוּא בִּמְגַדְּלִים אִיתְּמַר.
human_translation: And does Rava say this? But doesn’t Rava say: Shepherds of small livestock in Eretz Yisrael are disqualified Outside of Eretz they are fit herders of large livestock, even in Eretz Yisrael, are fit That was stated with regard to who raise
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And who said thus, Rava? But didn't Rava say: 'One who tends to a small animal in the land of Israel – it is disqualified; outside the land – it is valid. One who tends to a large animal, even in the land of Israel – it is valid.' That was stated in Migdalim."

hebrew_text: הָכִי נָמֵי מִסְתַּבְּרָא, מִדְּקָתָנֵי: נֶאֱמָנִין עָלַי שְׁלֹשָׁה רוֹעֵי בָקָר. מַאי לָאו, לְעֵדוּת?
human_translation: This too stands to reason, from that teaches Three cattle herders are trusted for me What, is it not with regard to bearing witness
llm_translation: Thus it was stated: when he is formed, from the Mishnah: they are believed upon three cattle herders. What is the reason? Is it not for testimony?

hebrew_text: לָא, לְדִינָא. דַּיְקָא נָמֵי, דְּקָתָנֵי: שְׁלֹשָׁה רוֹעֵי בָקָר. וְאִי לְעֵדוּת, שְׁלֹשָׁה לְמָה לִי?
human_translation: No, with regard to judgment. is also precise as it teaches: Three cattle herders And if with regard to bearing witness, why do I three
llm_translation: Not for the judgment. Sufficiently it is stated, as it is taught: "Three cattle herders." And if for testimony, why do I need three?

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא מַאי, לְדִינָא? מַאי אִירְיָא שְׁלֹשָׁה רוֹעֵי בָקָר? כֹּל בֵּי תְלָתָא דְּלָא גְּמִרִי דִּינָא נָמֵי!
human_translation: But rather, what with regard to judgment, why specifically three cattle herders? Any three who did not study halakha are also
llm_translation: And rather what, for the law? What is called three shepherds of cattle? All the houses of three that do not complete the law also!

hebrew_text: הָכִי קָאָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ הָנֵי דְּלָא שְׁכִיחִי בַּיִּישּׁוּב.
human_translation: This is saying: even those who do not frequent the settled area,
llm_translation: So it is stated: Even those that are not common in the return.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: סְתָם רוֹעֶה – פָּסוּל, סְתָם גַּבַּאי – כָּשֵׁר.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says: An ordinary shepherd disqualified An ordinary collector fit
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said: A shepherd who is not specifically designated - disqualified; a tax collector who is not specifically designated - valid.

hebrew_text: אֲבוּהּ דְּרַבִּי זֵירָא עֲבַד גַּבְיוּתָא תְּלֵיסַר שְׁנִין. כִּי הֲוָה אָתֵי רֵישׁ נַהֲרָא לְמָתָא, כִּי הֲוָה חָזֵי רַבָּנַן אֲמַר לְהוּ: ״לֵךְ עַמִּי בֹּא בַחֲדָרֶיךָ״. כִּי הֲוָה חָזֵי אִינָשֵׁי דְּמָתָא אָמַר: רֵישׁ נַהֲרָא אֲתָא לְמָתָא, וְהָאִידָּנָא נָכֵיס אַבָּא לְפוּם בְּרָא וּבְרָא לְפוּם אַבָּא,
human_translation: The father of Rabbi Zeira collected thirteen years. When the head river would come to the city, When he would see the rabbis, he would say to them “Come, my people, enter into your chambers, When he would see people of the city, he would say the head river is coming to the city, and will now slaughter the father, before the son, and the son before the father.
llm_translation: The father of Rabbi Zeira made a banquet for thirteen years. When the head of the river would come to the city, and when the sages would see him, he would say to them, "Go, my people, enter your rooms." When the people of the city would see the head of the river coming to the city, they would say, "The head of the river has come to the city, and now Abba has prepared a fish dish and Abba has prepared a meat dish."

hebrew_text: וּמִיגַּנְזוּ כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא. כִּי אָתֵי, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִמַּאן נִבְעֵי?
human_translation: And everyone would hide. When would arrive, would say to him: From whom shall I request
llm_translation: And from the treasury of the entire world. When he comes, he said to him: From where do you come?

hebrew_text: כִּי נִיחָא נַפְשֵׁיהּ, אֲמַר לְהוּ: שְׁקוּלוּ תְּלֵיסַר מָעֵי דְּצַיְירִי לִי בִּסְדִינַאי, וְאַהְדַּרוּ לֵיהּ לִפְלָנְיָא, דִּשְׁקַלְתִּינְהוּ מִינֵּיהּ וְלָא אִיצְטְרִיכוּ לִי.
human_translation: When he was dying, he said to Take thirteen ma’a that are tied up in my sheet and return them to so-and-so, as I took them from him but I did not need them
llm_translation: When his soul was appeased, he said to them: "Weigh the thirteen intestines that you painted for me in my garment, and return them to so-and-so, for I have weighed them and they are not necessary for me."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: בַּתְּחִילָּה הָיוּ קוֹרְאִין אוֹתָן ״אוֹסְפֵי שְׁבִיעִית״.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon said: Initially would call them: Gatherers of the Sabbatical
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon said: Initially, they would read them as "Osfei Shevi'it."

hebrew_text: מַאי קָאָמַר? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: הָכִי קָאָמַר, בַּתְּחִילָּה הָיוּ אוֹמְרִים: אוֹסְפֵי שְׁבִיעִית – כְּשֵׁרִין, סוֹחֲרִין – פְּסוּלִין.
human_translation: What is he saying? Rav Yehuda says this he is saying: Initially would say gatherers of Sabbatical are fit merchants disqualified.
llm_translation: What is he saying? Rav Yehudah said: This is what he is saying, initially they used to say: Gatherers of the seventh year produce are valid, merchants are invalid.

hebrew_text: מִשֶּׁרַבּוּ מַמְצִיאֵי מָעוֹת לַעֲנִיִּים, וְאָזְלִי עֲנִיִּים וְאָסְפִי לְהוּ וּמַיְיתוּ, חָזְרוּ לוֹמַר: אֶחָד זֶה וְאֶחָד זֶה פְּסוּלִין.
human_translation: Once those who would offer money to the poor grew abundant, and the poor would go and gather for and bring then said both this and that disqualified.
llm_translation: From when they increased the finders of coins for the poor, and the poor went and gathered them and died, they returned to say: "Both this one and that one are disqualified."

hebrew_text: קָשׁוּ בָּהּ בְּנֵי רַחֲבָה: הַאי ״מִשֶּׁרַבּוּ הָאַנָּסִים״? ״מִשֶּׁרַבּוּ הַתַּגָּרִין״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ!
human_translation: The children of Raḥava had a difficulty with this this Once the tax collectors grew abundant, should have Once the merchants grew abundant.
llm_translation: The sons of Rachav found it difficult: Is it "when the rapists increased"? It should be "when the merchants increased" that they require it!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, בַּתְּחִילָּה הָיוּ אוֹמְרִים: אֶחָד זֶה וְאֶחָד זֶה פְּסוּלִין. מִשֶּׁרַבּוּ הָאַנָּסִין – וּמַאי נִינְהוּ? אַרְנוֹנָא – כִּדְמַכְרִיז רַבִּי יַנַּאי: ״פּוּקוּ וּזְרַעוּ בַּשְּׁבִיעִית מִשּׁוּם אַרְנוֹנָא״. חָזְרוּ לוֹמַר: אוֹסְפִין כְּשֵׁרִין, סוֹחֲרִין פְּסוּלִין.
human_translation: Rather, Initially would say both this and that disqualified. Once the tax collectors grew abundant And what they Arnona , As Rabbi Yannai proclaimed: Go out and sow during the Sabbatical due to arnona then said: Gatherers are fit merchants are disqualified.
llm_translation: Rather, initially they would say: "Both this and this are invalid." Once the forced ones increased - and what are they? The arnona - as Rabbi Yannai proclaimed: "Go out and sow in the seventh year because of the arnona." They came back to say: Gatherers are valid, merchants are invalid.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר זַרְנוֹקֵי וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יְהוֹצָדָק הֲווֹ קָאָזְלִי לְעַבֵּר שָׁנָה בְּעַסְיָא. פְּגַע בְּהוּ רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ, אִיטַּפַּל בַּהֲדַיְיהוּ. אָמַר: אֵיזִיל אִיחְזֵי הֵיכִי עָבְדִי עוֹבָדָא.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Zarnokei and Rabbi Shimon ben Yehotzadak were going to intercalate the year in Asya, Reish Lakish met them joined with them. He said: I will go see how they do the deed,
llm_translation: Rabbi Chiya bar Zarnokey and Rabbi Shimon ben Yehotzadak were going to pass through Asya. Reish Lakish met them, he joined them. He said: "Where shall I go to see how to do the matter?"

hebrew_text: חַזְיֵיהּ לְהָהוּא גַּבְרָא דְּקָא כָרֵיב. אָמַר לָהֶן: כֹּהֵן וְחוֹרֵשׁ! אָמְרוּ לוֹ, יָכוֹל לוֹמַר: ״אַגִּיסְטְוָן אֲנִי בְּתוֹכוֹ״.
human_translation: saw a certain man plowing He said to priest plowing They said to him could say I am a hired worker [ agiston ] in
llm_translation: He saw that man approaching. He said to them: "A priest and a plower!" They said to him, "He could have said, 'I am a guest among you.'"

hebrew_text: תּוּ חַזְיֵיהּ לְהָהוּא גַּבְרָא דַּהֲוָה כָּסַח בְּכַרְמֵי. אָמַר לָהֶן: כֹּהֵן וְזָמַר! אָמְרוּ לוֹ: יָכוֹל לוֹמַר ״לְעֵקֶל בֵּית הַבַּד אֲנִי צָרִיךְ״. אָמַר לָהֶם: הַלֵּב יוֹדֵעַ אִם לְעֵקֶל אִם לַעֲקַלְקַלּוֹת.
human_translation: further saw a certain man pruning in vineyards. He said to priest pruning They said to him could say: I need to a bale [ ekel ] olive press, said to them, The heart knows whether for a bale [ ekel ], or as deceit [ la’akalkalot ].
llm_translation: Behold, he saw that certain man who was pruning in the vineyard. He said to them: "A priest and a singer!" They said to him: "He could have said, 'I need a pruning knife for the vineyard.'" He said to them: "The heart knows whether for pruning or for causing damage."

hebrew_text: הֵי אֲמַר לְהוּ בְּרֵישָׁא? אִילֵימָא הָא קַמַּיְיתָא אֲמַר לְהוּ בְּרֵישָׁא, הָא נָמֵי לֵימְרוּ: ״אַגִּיסְטְוָן אֲנִי בְּתוֹכוֹ״! אֶלָּא, הָא אֲמַר לְהוּ בְּרֵישָׁא, וַהֲדַר אֲמַר לְהוּ הָךְ.
human_translation: Which did he say to them first? If we say first he said to them that first let them say this too, I am a hired worker in Rather, first he said to them this and then he said to them that
llm_translation: Hei amar lehu bereishah? Ileima ha kamayata amar lehu bereishah, ha namei leimru: "Agishtvan ani betokho"! Ella, ha amar lehu bereishah, vahadar amar lehu hak.

hebrew_text: מַאי שְׁנָא כֹּהֵן? מִשּׁוּם דַּחֲשִׁידִי אַשְּׁבִיעִית.
human_translation: What is different a priest? because are suspected of Sabbatical
llm_translation: What is different about a Kohen? Because he is suspected regarding the seventh generation.

hebrew_text: דִּתְנַן: סְאָה תְּרוּמָה שֶׁנָּפְלָה לְמֵאָה סְאִין שֶׁל שְׁבִיעִית – תַּעֲלֶה. פָּחוֹת מִיכֵּן – יֵרָקְבוּ.
human_translation: As we learned A se’a of teruma , that fell into a hundred se’a of Sabbatical is nullified, a lesser must rot,
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: If a se'ah of terumah falls into one hundred se'ah of produce of the seventh year - it will ascend. If less than that - it will rot.

hebrew_text: וְהָוֵינַן בַּהּ: אַמַּאי יֵרָקְבוּ? יִמְכְּרֶנּוּ לַכֹּהֵן בִּדְמֵי תְרוּמָה, חוּץ מִדְּמֵי אוֹתָהּ סְאָה.
human_translation: And we discussed it: Why must rot? Let sell it to a priest in accordance with value as teruma , except for the value of that se’a
llm_translation: And we ask in it: Why should they decay? Sell it to the priest for the price of a contribution, except for the price of that se'ah.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב חִיָּיא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּעוּלָּא: זֹאת אוֹמֶרֶת, נֶחְשְׁדוּ כֹּהֲנִים אַשְּׁבִיעִית.
human_translation: And Rav Ḥiyya said in the name of Ulla: That is to say, priests are suspected of the Sabbatical
llm_translation: And Rav Chiya said in the name of Ulla: This is what it means, "The priests were suspected on the seventh day."

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ: טָרוֹדָא הוּא דֵּין. כִּי מְטוֹ לְהָתָם, סְלִיקוּ לְאִיגָּרָא, שַׁלְּפוּהּ לְדַרְגָּא מִתּוּתֵיהּ.
human_translation: said: This one is a nuisance. when they reached they went up to the roof took the ladder out from under them
llm_translation: They said: "Taroda is the law." When they come there, bring it up to the roof, and take it down a step from its place.

hebrew_text: אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בְּנֵי אָדָם הַחֲשׁוּדִין עַל הַשְּׁבִיעִית, כְּשֵׁרִין לְעַבֵּר שָׁנָה?
human_translation: came before Rabbi Yoḥanan. said to him: people who are suspected of the Sabbatical fit to intercalate the year?
llm_translation: He came before Rabbi Yochanan. He said to him: Are human beings suspected regarding the seventh year, permitted to transgress the laws of the Sabbatical year?

hebrew_text: הֲדַר אָמַר: לָא קַשְׁיָא לִי, מִידֵּי דְּהָוֵה אַשְּׁלֹשָׁה רוֹעֵי בָקָר, וְרַבָּנַן אַחוּשְׁבָּנַיְיהוּ סְמוּךְ.
human_translation: then said not difficult for me; just as three cattle herders the Sages depended on their calculation,
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates to: "Hadar said: It is not difficult for me, since there were three cattle herders, and the Rabbis considered them trustworthy."

hebrew_text: וַהֲדַר אָמַר: לָא דָּמֵי. הָתָם, הֲדוּר אִימְּנוֹ רַבָּנַן וְעַבְּרוּהָ לְהָהִוא שַׁתָּא. הָכָא, קֶשֶׁר רְשָׁעִים הוּא, וְקֶשֶׁר רְשָׁעִים אֵינוֹ מִן הַמִּנְיָן. אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: דָּא עָקָא.
human_translation: and then said: It is not similar. There, afterward the Sages were counted, and intercalated that year Here, it is a conspiracy of wicked people, and a conspiracy of wicked people is not counted. Rabbi Yoḥanan said: This is troublesome.
llm_translation: And afterwards he said: It is not similar. There, the sages adorned it and passed it to that year. Here, it is a knot of evildoers, and a knot of evildoers is not included in the count. Rabbi Yochanan said: This is a difficult matter.

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתוֹ לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: קָרֵי לַן ״רוֹעֵי בָקָר״, וְלָא אֲמַר לֵיהּ מָר וְלָא מִידֵּי? אֲמַר לְהוּ: וְאִי קָרֵי לְכוּ ״רוֹעֵי צֹאן״, מַאי אָמֵינָא לֵיהּ?
human_translation: When came before Rabbi Yoḥanan, they said to him referred to us as cattle herders, and the Master said nothing to him said to them And if he had referred to you as shepherds, what should I have said to him?
llm_translation: When they came before Rabbi Yochanan, they said to him: "He calls us 'cattle breeders,' and does not call us 'masters'? He said to them: If he were to call you 'sheep breeders,' what would I say to him?

hebrew_text: מַאי קֶשֶׁר רְשָׁעִים? שֶׁבְנָא הֲוָה דָּרֵישׁ בִּתְלֵיסַר רִבְּוָותָא, חִזְקִיָּה הֲוָה דָּרֵישׁ בְּחַד סַר רִבְּוָותָא.
human_translation: What a conspiracy of wicked people Shebna, He would teach to 130,000 Hezekiah would teach to 110,000
llm_translation: What is the connection of the wicked? That Nebuchadnezzar sought to destroy three hundred and thirteen myriads, Hezekiah sought to destroy only one myriad.

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא סַנְחֵרִיב וְצַר עֲלַהּ דִּירוּשְׁלֶם, כְּתַב שֶׁבְנָא פִּתְקָא שְׁדָא בְּגִירָא: ״שֶׁבְנָא וְסִיעָתוֹ הִשְׁלִימוּ, חִזְקִיָּה וְסִיעָתוֹ לֹא הִשְׁלִימוּ״. שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי הִנֵּה הָרְשָׁעִים יִדְרְכוּן קֶשֶׁת כּוֹנְנוּ חִצָּם עַל יֶתֶר״.
human_translation: When Sennacherib came and besieged Jerusalem, Shebna wrote a note and shot with an arrow. Shebna and his camp have appeased Hezekiah and his camp have not appeased As it is stated “For behold, the wicked bend the bow, they have made ready their arrow upon the string”
llm_translation: When Sancheiriv came and laid siege to Jerusalem, he wrote a letter and placed it in an arrow: "Sancheiriv and his entourage have made peace, Hezekiah and his entourage have not made peace." As it is stated: "For behold, the wicked bend the bow, they set their arrow upon the string."

hebrew_text: הֲוָה קָא מִסְתְּפֵי חִזְקִיָּה, אֲמַר: דִּילְמָא חַס וְשָׁלוֹם נָטְיָה דַּעְתֵּיהּ דְּקוּדְשָׁא בְּרִיךְ הוּא בָּתַר רוּבָּא, כֵּיוָן דְּרוּבָּא מִימַּסְרִי אִינְהוּ נָמֵי מִימַּסְרִי. בָּא נָבִיא וְאָמַר לוֹ: ״לֹא תֹאמְרוּן קֶשֶׁר לְכֹל אֲשֶׁר יֹאמַר הָעָם הַזֶּה קָשֶׁר״, כְּלוֹמַר, קֶשֶׁר רְשָׁעִים הוּא, וְקֶשֶׁר רְשָׁעִים אֵינוֹ מִן הַמִּנְיָן.
human_translation: Hezekiah was afraid. He said: Perhaps, God forbid, the opinion of the Holy One, Blessed be He, will follow the majority; since the majority have submitted those will also be submitted The prophet came and said to him: “Say not: A conspiracy, concerning all of which this people say: A conspiracy” Meaning, it is a conspiracy of wicked people, and a conspiracy of wicked people is not counted.
llm_translation: Hezekiah was becoming weak, he said: Perhaps Hezekiah's mind inclined towards the Holy One, blessed be He, after the majority, since the majority incline, they are also inclined. A prophet came and said to him: "Do not say, 'Conspiracy,' concerning everything that this people says is a conspiracy," meaning, it is a conspiracy of wicked people, and a conspiracy of wicked people is not part of the count.

hebrew_text: הָלַךְ לַחְצֹב לוֹ קֶבֶר בְּקִבְרֵי בֵּית דָּוִד. בָּא נָבִיא וְאָמַר לוֹ: ״מָה לְּךָ פֹה וּמִי לְךָ פֹה כִּי חָצַבְתָּ לְּךָ פֹּה קָבֶר... הִנֵּה ה׳ מְטַלְטֶלְךָ טַלְטֵלָה גָּבֶר״.
human_translation: went to carve out a grave for himself among the graves of the house of David, The prophet came and said to him: “What have you here, and whom have you here, that you have carved out a grave for yourself here? Behold, the Lord will make you wander like the wandering of a man;
llm_translation: He went to hew for himself a grave in the tombs of the House of David. A prophet came and said to him: "What is it to you here, and who is it to you here, that you hewed for yourself here a grave... Behold, the Lord is about to shake you, shake you, O man."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב: טִלְטוּלָא דְּגַבְרָא קָשֵׁי מִדְּאִיתְּתָא.
human_translation: Rav says the wandering of a man is more difficult than that of a woman.
llm_translation: Rav said: The carrying of a man is more difficult than that of a woman.

hebrew_text: ״וְעֹטְךָ עָטֹה״ – אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: מְלַמֵּד שֶׁפָּרְחָה בּוֹ צָרַעַת. כְּתִיב הָכָא ״וְעֹטְךָ עָטֹה״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם ״וְעַל שָׂפָם יַעְטֶה״.
human_translation: “And he will wind you round and round,” Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, says: teaches that developed leprosy; it is written here: “And he will wind you round and round [ ve’otkha ato ],” and it is written there, and he shall cover his upper lip [ ya’te ]”
llm_translation: "And he shall cover his upper lip" - Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Chanina, said: This teaches that leprosy bloomed on him. It is written here "and he shall cover his upper lip," and it is written there "and upon his upper lip he shall cover."

hebrew_text: ״צָנוֹף יִצְנׇפְךָ צְנֵפָה כַּדּוּר אֶל אֶרֶץ רַחֲבַת יָדָיִם וְגוֹ׳״. תָּנָא: הוּא בִּיקֵּשׁ קְלוֹן בֵּית אֲדֹנָיו, לְפִיכָךְ נֶהְפַּךְ כְּבוֹדוֹ לְקָלוֹן. כִּי הֲוָה נָפֵיק אִיהוּ, אֲתָא גַּבְרִיאֵל אַחְדֵּיהּ לְדַשָּׁא בְּאַפֵּי מַשְׁרְיָיתֵיהּ.
human_translation: “He will violently roll and toss you like a ball into a large country; taught: He, desired shame for his master’s house; therefore his glory turned to shame. When he was going out Gabriel came held the gate in front of his camp
llm_translation: "Tzafnoph will sting you, a serpent will sting you like a viper upon a broad land." It was taught: He sought disgrace for his master's house, therefore his honor was turned into disgrace. When he went out, Gabriel came and slapped him on his cheeks.

hebrew_text: אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: מַשְׁירְיָיתָךְ הֵיכָא? אֲמַר: הֲדַרוּ בִּי. אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: אִם כֵּן, אַחוֹכֵי קָא מַחְיְיכַתְּ בַּן! נְקָבוּהוּ בַּעֲקָבָיו וּתְלָאוּהוּ בְּזַנְבֵי סוּסֵיהֶם, וְהָיוּ מְגָרְרִין אוֹתוֹ עַל הַקּוֹצִים וְעַל הַבַּרְקָנִין.
human_translation: said to him: Where is your camp? said: They backed out on me. They said to him: If so, you are mocking us; They punched holes in his heels and hung him by the tails of their horses, and dragged him on the thorns and on the bristles.
llm_translation: They said to him: Where is your maidservant? He said: She adorned herself for me. They said to him: If so, a harlot is laughing at the son! They pierced his heels and hung him on the tails of their horses, and dragged him over thorns and thistles.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: שֶׁבְנָא בַּעַל הֲנָאָה הָיָה. כְּתִיב הָכָא: ״לֶךְ בֹּא אֶל הַסֹּכֵן הַזֶּה״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם: ״וַתְּהִי לוֹ סֹכֶנֶת״.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar says: Shebna was a hedonist. It is written here: “Go, get yourself to this steward [ hasokhen ], and it is written there “And let her be a companion [ sokhenet ] to him;
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: Shevna was a pleasure-seeker. It is written here: "Go, inquire of this steward," and it is written there: "And she became his stewardess."

hebrew_text: וְאוֹמֵר: ״כִּי הַשָּׁתוֹת יֵהָרֵסוּן צַדִּיק מַה פָּעָל״. רַב יְהוּדָה וְרַב עֵינָא, חַד אָמַר: אִילּוּ חִזְקִיָּה וְסִיעָתוֹ נֶהֱרָסִים, צַדִּיק מַה פָּעָל? וְחַד אָמַר: אִילּוּ בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ יַהָרֵס, צַדִּיק מַה פָּעָל? וְעוּלָּא אָמַר: אִילּוּ מַחְשְׁבוֹתָיו שֶׁל אוֹתוֹ רָשָׁע אֵינָן נֶהֱרָסוֹת, צַדִּיק מַה פָּעָל?
human_translation: And states: “When the foundations are destroyed, what has the Righteous One done?” Rav Yehuda and Rav Eina One says: If Hezekiah and his camp are destroyed, what has the Righteous One done? And one says: If the Temple should be destroyed, what has the Righteous One done? And Ulla says: If the intentions of that wicked person, are not destroyed, what has the Righteous One done?
llm_translation: And he says: "When the foundations are destroyed, what has the righteous done?" Rav Yehudah and Rav Eina, one said: If Hezekiah and his associates are destroyed, what has the righteous done? And one said: If the Temple is destroyed, what has the righteous done? And Ulla said: If the evil thoughts of that wicked person are not destroyed, what has the righteous done?

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר: אִילּוּ מַחְשְׁבוֹתָיו שֶׁל אוֹתוֹ רָשָׁע, הַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב ״כִּי הַשָּׁתוֹת יֵהָרֵסוּן״.
human_translation: Granted, according to the one who says If the intentions of that wicked person this is that it is written: “When the foundations [ hashatot ] are destroyed,”
llm_translation: In truth, according to the one who says: If only the evil thoughts of that wicked one, that is what is written, "For the plans of the deceitful will be frustrated."

hebrew_text: וּלְמַאן דְּאָמַר בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ, נָמֵי – דִּתְנַן: אֶבֶן הָיְתָה שָׁם מִימוֹת נְבִיאִים הָרִאשׁוֹנִים, וּשְׁתִיָּיה הָיְתָה נִקְרֵאת.
human_translation: And according to the one who says the Temple, also as we learned There was a stone from the days of the early prophets, and was called Foundation [ shetiyya ]
llm_translation: And for the one who says the Temple, yes - as we learned: There was a stone there from the days of the early prophets, and it was called Shetiyyah.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר חִזְקִיָּה וְסִיעָתוֹ, הֵיכָא אַשְׁכְּחַן צַדִּיקֵי דְּאִיקְּרוּ ״שָׁתוֹת״?
human_translation: But according to the one who says Hezekiah and his camp, where do we find that righteous people are referred to as shatot ?
llm_translation: Rather, according to Hezekiah and his colleagues, where do we find righteous individuals who were called "drunkards"?

hebrew_text: דִּכְתִיב: ״כִּי לַה׳ מְצֻקֵי אֶרֶץ וַיָּשֶׁת עֲלֵיהֶם תֵּבֵל״. וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא מֵהָכָא: ״הִפְלִיא עֵצָה הִגְדִּיל תּוּשִׁיָּה״.
human_translation: As it is written: for the pillars of the earth are the Lord’s, and He has set [ vayyashet ] the world upon them” And if you wish, say from here: “Wonderful is His counsel, and great His wisdom [ tushiyya ]”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: It is written: "For the Lord are the foundations of the earth, and He set the world upon them." And if you wish, say it from here: "Wonderful in counsel, excellent in wisdom."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חָנָן: לָמָּה נִקְרָא שְׁמָהּ תּוּשִׁיָּה? מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהִיא מַתֶּשֶׁת כֹּחוֹ שֶׁל אָדָם. דָּבָר אַחֵר: תּוּשִׁיָּה – שֶׁנִּיתְּנָה בַּחֲשַׁאי מִפְּנֵי הַשָּׂטָן. דָּבָר אַחֵר: תּוּשִׁיָּה – דְּבָרִים שֶׁל תּוֹהוּ שֶׁהָעוֹלָם מְשׁוּתָּת עֲלֵיהֶם.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanan says: Why is called tushiyya ? Because it weakens [ matteshet ] the strength of a person Alternatively, tushiyya That it was given in secret [ shenittena beḥashai ]. because of the Satan, Alternatively, tushiyya amorphous [ tohu ] matters that the world is founded [ meshotat ] on them.
llm_translation: Rabbi Hanan said: Why is her name called Tushiya? Because she weakens the strength of a person. Another explanation: Tushiya - that she was given in secret because of the Satan. Another explanation: Tushiya - matters of confusion upon which the world is dependent.

hebrew_text: אָמַר עוּלָּא: מַחְשָׁבָה מוֹעֶלֶת אֲפִילּוּ לְדִבְרֵי תוֹרָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״מֵפֵר מַחְשְׁבוֹת עֲרוּמִים וְלֹא תַעֲשֶׂינָה יְדֵיהֶם תּוּשִׁיָּה״.
human_translation: Ulla says: Thought, is effective [ mo’elet ] in even statements of Torah, as it is stated: “He frustrates the thoughts of the crafty, so that their hands can perform nothing [ velo…tushiyya ]”
llm_translation: Ula said: A harmful thought is detrimental even in matters of Torah, as it is stated: "He frustrates the devices of the crafty, so that their hands achieve no success."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה: אִם עֲסוּקִין לִשְׁמָהּ, אֵינָהּ מוֹעֶלֶת, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״רַבּוֹת מַחֲשָׁבוֹת בְּלֶב אִישׁ וַעֲצַת ה׳ הִיא תָקוּם״. עֵצָה שֶׁיֵּשׁ בָּהּ דְּבַר ה׳ הִיא תָּקוּם לְעוֹלָם.
human_translation: Rabba says: If engage for its own sake, is not effective; as it is stated: “There are many devices in a man’s heart; but the counsel of the Lord, that shall stand” a counsel that has in it the statement of the Lord shall rise forever
llm_translation: Rabba said: If one is engaged for its sake, it is not futile, as it is stated: "Many thoughts are in a man's heart, but the counsel of the Lord, it shall stand." A counsel that has in it the word of the Lord, it shall stand forever.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אֵימָתַי. אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: When Rabbi Abbahu says Rabbi Elazar says: The halakha in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yehuda: When? Said Rabbi Abahu in the name of Rabbi Elazar: The halakha is according to Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: כּוּלָּן צְרִיכִין הַכְרָזָה בְּבֵית דִּין.
human_translation: And Rabbi Abbahu says Rabbi Elazar says: All of require a proclamation in the court.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Avahu said in the name of Rabbi Elazar: All of them require a proclamation in the court.

hebrew_text: רוֹעֶה – פְּלִיגִי בַּהּ רַב אַחָא וְרָבִינָא: חַד אָמַר בָּעֵי הַכְרָזָה, וְחַד אָמַר לָא בָּעֵי הַכְרָזָה.
human_translation: a shepherd, Rav Aḥa and Ravina disagree. One says he requires a proclamation and one says he does not require a proclamation
llm_translation: Shepherd - Rav Acha and Ravina disagree about it: one said it requires proclamation, and one said it does not require proclamation.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר לָא בָּעֵי הַכְרָזָה, הַיְינוּ דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: סְתָם רוֹעֶה פָּסוּל. אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר בָּעֵי הַכְרָזָה, מַאי סְתָם רוֹעֶה פָּסוּל?
human_translation: Granted, according to the one who says he does not require a proclamation, this is what Rav Yehuda says Rav says an ordinary shepherd is disqualified, But according to the one who says requires a proclamation, what an ordinary shepherd is disqualified?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: In truth, according to the one who says that proclamation is not necessary, that is as Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: An anonymous shepherd is disqualified. But according to the one who says that proclamation is necessary, what is the disqualification of an anonymous shepherd?

hebrew_text: דְּבִסְתָמָא מַכְרְזִינַן עֲלֵיהּ.
human_translation: that in an ordinary proclaims about him
llm_translation: We announce about it in a public proclamation.

hebrew_text: הָהִיא מַתָּנָה דַּהֲווֹ חֲתִימִי עֲלַהּ תְּרֵין גַּזְלָנִין, סְבַר רַב פָּפָּא בַּר שְׁמוּאֵל לְאַכְשׁוֹרַהּ, דְּהָא לָא אַכְרְזִינַן עֲלַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: a certain gift on which two robbers were signed, Rav Pappa bar Shmuel thought to deem it valid as did not proclaim about them
llm_translation: That gift that had two thieves sign on it, Rav Papa son of Shmuel thought to return it, for we do not announce about them.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא: נְהִי דְּבָעֵינַן הַכְרָזָה בְּגַזְלָן דְּרַבָּנַן, בְּגַזְלָן דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא מִי בָּעֵינַן הַכְרָזָה?
human_translation: Rava said to him: Although we require a proclamation with regard to a robber by rabbinic law; with regard to a robber by Torah law, do we require a proclamation?
llm_translation: He said to him, Rava: Granted that we require a public proclamation for the theft of Rabbinic property, but for the theft of Torah law, do we require a public proclamation?

hebrew_text: סִימָן: דָּבָר, וַעֲרָיוֹת, גַּנָּב.
human_translation: a mnemonic Something; and forbidden sexual relations; a thief.
llm_translation: Topic: Word, and Forbidden Relationships, Theft.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: אוֹכְלֵי דָּבָר אַחֵר פְּסוּלִין לְעֵדוּת.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman says: Those who eat something else, are disqualified from bearing witness.
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said: Those who eat another thing are disqualified for testimony.

hebrew_text: הָנֵי מִילֵּי בְּפַרְהֶסְיָא, אֲבָל בְּצִינְעָה לָא. וּבְפַרְהֶסְיָא נָמֵי לָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא דְּאֶפְשָׁר לֵיהּ לְאִיתְּזוֹנֵי בְּצִינְעָה, וְקָא מְבַזֵּי נַפְשֵׁיהּ בְּפַרְהֶסְיָא. אֲבָל לָא אֶפְשָׁר לֵיהּ – חַיּוּתֵיהּ הוּא.
human_translation: This statement in public [ befarhesya ], but in private not And even in public, we said only where he can sustain in private and he disgraces himself in public. But he cannot it is his livelihood.
llm_translation: These matters in the marketplace, but not in private. And in the marketplace, we do not say this except that it is possible for him to sustain himself in private, and he is degrading himself in the marketplace. But if it is not possible for him - it is his livelihood.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: הֶחָשׁוּד עַל הָעֲרָיוֹת כָּשֵׁר לְעֵדוּת. אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: עֲנִי מָרִי, אַרְבְּעִין בְּכַתְפֵּיהּ וְכָשֵׁר?
human_translation: Rav Naḥman says: One who is suspected of forbidden sexual relations is fit to bear witness. Rav Sheshet said Answer me, my Master: forty on his shoulders, and he is fit
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said: One suspected of illicit relations is fit to testify. Rav Sheshet said: A poor person, does forty on his shoulders make him fit?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: וּמוֹדֶה רַב נַחְמָן לְעִנְיַן עֵדוּת אִשָּׁה שֶׁהוּא פָּסוּל. אָמַר רָבִינָא, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַב פָּפָּא: לָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא לְאַפּוֹקַהּ, אֲבָל לְעַיּוֹלַהּ – לֵית לַן בַּהּ.
human_translation: Rava said: And Rav Naḥman concedes that he is disqualified with regard to testimony woman, Ravina says, and some say Rav Pappa We said only with regard to removes her But with regard to establishes her we have no with it.
llm_translation: Rava said: And Rav Nachman concedes regarding the matter of the testimony of a woman that it is invalid. Ravina said, and it was stated by Rav Papa: We only said this in order to disqualify her, but to establish her credibility - we do not have a basis in it.

hebrew_text: פְּשִׁיטָא! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא הָא עֲדִיפָא לֵיהּ, דִּכְתִיב: ״מַיִם גְּנוּבִים יִמְתָּקוּ וְגוֹ׳״? קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דְּכַמָּה דְּקַיְימָא הָכִי שְׁכִיחָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: obvious? Lest you say this is preferable to him; as it is written: “Stolen waters are sweet teaches us as the way is she is available to him.
llm_translation: It is obvious! What is the reasoning that this is preferable to him, as it is written: "Stolen waters are sweet, and bread eaten in secret is pleasant"? This teaches us that as much as it is established, so is it common for him.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: גַּנַּב נִיסָן וְגַנַּב תִּשְׁרֵי – לָא שְׁמֵיהּ גַּנָּב.
human_translation: And Rav Naḥman says: A thief of Nisan and a thief of Tishrei, is not called a thief
llm_translation: And Rav Nachman said: "A thief in Nisan and a thief in Tishrei - his name is not called a thief."

hebrew_text: וְהָנֵי מִילֵּי בַּאֲרִיסָא, וְדָבָר מוּעָט, וּבְדָבָר שֶׁנִּגְמְרָה מְלַאכְתּוֹ.
human_translation: This statement with regard to a tenant farmer, and a small amount, and in an item whose work was completed,
llm_translation: These are the matters in the field, and a small matter, and in a matter that his work is completed.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּרֵיהּ דְּרַב זְבִיד, חַד גְּנַב קַבָּא דִשְׂעָרֵי, וּפַסְלֵיהּ, וְחַד גְּנַב קִיבּוּרָא דַאֲהִינֵי, וּפַסְלֵיהּ.
human_translation: the farmers of Rav Zevid. One stole a kav of barley, and disqualified him and one stole a cluster of dates, and he disqualified him.
llm_translation: The field of Rav Zevid, one stole a kab of barley, its vessels, and one stole a grave of olive trees, and its vessels.

hebrew_text: הָנְהוּ קָבוֹרָאֵי דִּקְבוּר נַפְשָׁא בְּיוֹם טוֹב רִאשׁוֹן שֶׁל עֲצֶרֶת, שַׁמְּתִינְהוּ רַב פָּפָּא וּפַסְלִינְהוּ לְעֵדוּת, וְאַכְשְׁרִינְהוּ רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ.
human_translation: these gravediggers, who buried a person on the first day of the festival of Shavuot , Rav Pappa excommunicated them and disqualified them from bearing witness, and Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, deemed them fit
llm_translation: Those who bury the deceased on the first day of Shavuot, Rab Papa waits for them and disqualifies them as witnesses, and Rab Huna son of Rav Yehoshua validates them.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב פָּפָּא: וְהָא רְשָׁעִים נִינְהוּ? סָבְרִי: מִצְוָה קָא עָבְדִי.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said to But aren’t they wicked people, They assumed they were doing a mitzva,
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Papa: But are they wicked? We hold: They are performing a commandment.

hebrew_text: וְהָא קָא מְשַׁמְּתִינַן לְהוּ? סָבְרִי: כַּפָּרָה קָא עָבְדִי לַן רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: But didn’t I excommunicate them They assumed: the Sages are achieving atonement for us,
llm_translation: And this, are we to infer for them? They hold: The atonement is being done for us, O Rabbis.

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר:
human_translation: It was stated
llm_translation: It was stated:

hebrew_text: עֵד זוֹמֵם, אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: לְמַפְרֵעַ הוּא נִפְסָל; וְרָבָא אָמַר: מִיכָּן וּלְהַבָּא הוּא נִפְסָל.
human_translation: a conspiring witness: Abaye says: He is disqualified retroactively, And Rava says: He is disqualified from that point forward,
llm_translation: Witness who plots, Abaye said: disqualified; and Rava said: from here and onwards disqualified.

hebrew_text: אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: לְמַפְרֵעַ הוּא נִפְסָל, מֵעִידָּנָא דְּאַסְהֵיד רָשָׁע הוּא, וְהַתּוֹרָה אָמְרָה: ״אַל תָּשֶׁת יָדְךָ עִם רָשָׁע״ – אַל תָּשֶׁת רָשָׁע עֵד.
human_translation: Abaye says he is disqualified retroactively from that time when he testified he is a wicked man. And the Torah stated: “Do not put your hand with the wicked Do not a wicked man a witness.
llm_translation: Abaye said: To act rebelliously he is disqualified, as we testify that one who testifies is wicked, and the Torah said: "Do not join hands with a wicked person" - do not make a wicked person a witness.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: מִיכָּן וּלְהַבָּא הוּא נִפְסָל. עֵד זוֹמֵם חִידּוּשׁ הוּא, מַאי חָזֵית דְּסָמְכַתְּ אַהָנֵי? סְמוֹךְ אַהָנֵי! אֵין לָךְ בּוֹ אֶלָּא מִשְּׁעַת חִידּוּשׁוֹ וְאֵילָךְ.
human_translation: Rava says that he is disqualified from that point forward a conspiring witness is a novelty, What did you see that you rely on rely upon you have him only from the time of its novelty and onward;
llm_translation: Rava said: From here and onwards it is disqualified. A conspiring witness is a novelty, what did you see that you relied on his testimony? You relied on his testimony! You have nothing in it except from the time of his novelty and onwards.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְאָמְרִי: רָבָא נָמֵי כְּאַבַּיֵּי סְבִירָא לֵיהּ, וּמַאי טַעַם קָאָמַר מִכָּאן וּלְהַבָּא? מִשּׁוּם פְּסֵידָא דְלָקוֹחוֹת.
human_translation: There are who say Rava also holds like Abaye, And what is the reason says from that point forward? due to loss for purchasers,
llm_translation: There are some who say: Rava also, like his forefathers, holds it plausible, and what is the reason he says from here and onwards? Because of the loss incurred by the buyers.

hebrew_text: מַאי בֵּינַיְיהוּ? אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ דְּאַסְהִידוּ בֵּי תְרֵי בְּחַד. אִי נָמֵי, דְּפַסְלִינְהוּ בְּגַזְלָנוּתָא.
human_translation: What is between there is between them where two testify about one Alternatively, where disqualified by robbery
llm_translation: What is the difference between them? There is a difference between them in that they testified in the house of two in one. If you say so, that they were also disqualified by theft.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה מִדִּיפְתִּי: עֲבַד רַב פַּפִּי עוֹבָדָא כְּוָותֵיהּ דְּרָבָא. מָר בַּר רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: הִלְכְתָא כְּוָותֵיהּ דְּאַבָּיֵי.
human_translation: And Rav Yirmeya of Difti related: Rav Pappi performed an action, in accordance with of Rava. Mar bar Rav Ashi says: The halakha in accordance with of Abaye.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yirmeya from Difti said: Rav Pappi did a deed like the deed of Rava. Mar bar Rav Ashi said: The halakha is like the opinion of Abbaye.

hebrew_text: וְהִלְכְתָא כְּוָותֵיהּ דְּאַבָּיֵי בְּ״יַעַ״ל קַגַ״ם״.
human_translation: And the halakha in accordance with of Abaye. In yod , ayin , lamed , kuf , gimmel , mem :
llm_translation: And the halakha is in accordance with the opinion of Abbaye in the matter of "Ya'al Kagem."

hebrew_text: מוּמָר אוֹכֵל נְבֵילוֹת לְתֵיאָבוֹן – דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל פָּסוּל.
human_translation: a transgressor eats carcasses, due to appetite, everyone agrees disqualified
llm_translation: Mumar ocheil neveilot leteiavon - divrei hakol pasul.

hebrew_text: לְהַכְעִיס – אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: פָּסוּל, רָבָא אָמַר: כָּשֵׁר.
human_translation: to express insolence, Abaye says disqualified Rava says fit.
llm_translation: To anger - Abbaye said: invalid, Rava said: valid.

hebrew_text: אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: פָּסוּל, דְּהָוֵה לֵיהּ רָשָׁע, וְרַחֲמָנָא אָמַר ״אַל תָּשֶׁת רָשָׁע עֵד״. וְרָבָא אָמַר: כָּשֵׁר, רָשָׁע דְּחָמָס בָּעֵינַן.
human_translation: Abaye says disqualified because he is wicked, and the Merciful One states: Do not put the wicked a witness. And Rava says fit we require a wicked person of a monetary transgression deḥamas ,
llm_translation: Abaye said: Disqualified, for he is considered wicked, and the Merciful One said, "Do not place a wicked person as a witness." And Rava said: Valid, for we require a wicked person who is guilty of violence.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: ״אַל תָּשֶׁת רָשָׁע עֵד״, ״אַל תָּשֶׁת חָמָס עֵד״ – אֵלּוּ גַּזְלָנִין וּמוֹעֲלִין בִּשְׁבוּעוֹת. מַאי לָאו, אֶחָד שְׁבוּעַת שָׁוְא וְאֶחָד שְׁבוּעַת מָמוֹן?
human_translation: raises an objection Do not put the wicked a witness; do not put a monetary transgression a witness. These are robbers and betray oaths, What, doesn’t both an oath in vain, and an oath monetary matters?
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: A question was raised: "Do not be a wicked witness," "Do not be a violent witness" - these are thieves and deceivers in oaths. What is the difference? One is an oath of falsehood and one is an oath of money?

hebrew_text: לָא, אִידִי וְאִידִי שְׁבוּעַת מָמוֹן. וּמַאי ״שְׁבוּעוֹת״? שְׁבוּעוֹת דְּעָלְמָא.
human_translation: No, this and that are oaths monetary matters. And what oaths, oaths in general,
llm_translation: Not, both, oath of money. And what is "oaths"? Oaths of the world.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: ״אַל תָּשֶׁת רָשָׁע עֵד״, ״אַל תָּשֶׁת חָמָס עֵד״ – אֵלּוּ גַּזְלָנִין וּמַלְוֵי רִבִּיּוֹת. תְּיוּבְתָּא דְאַבָּיֵי, תְּיוּבְתָּא.
human_translation: raises an objection Do not put the wicked a witness; do not put a monetary transgression a witness. These are robbers and lend interest. The refutation of Abaye a conclusive refutation.
llm_translation: Challenger: "Do not place a wicked person as a witness," "Do not place a violent person as a witness" - these are thieves and usurers. The question raised by Abbaye, the question.

hebrew_text: נֵימָא כְּתַנָּאֵי: עֵד זוֹמֵם פָּסוּל לְכׇל הַתּוֹרָה כּוּלָּהּ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים? שֶׁהוּזַם בְּדִינֵי נְפָשׁוֹת; אֲבָל הוּזַם בְּדִינֵי מָמוֹנוֹת – כָּשֵׁר לְדִינֵי נְפָשׁוֹת.
human_translation: Let us say is parallel tanna’im : A conspiring witness disqualified about any the entire Torah. the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yosei says: In what is this statement said? Where he was rendered a conspiring witness with regard to capital law; But was rendered a conspiring witness with regard to monetary law, he is fit to capital law,
llm_translation: Said as the Tannaim: A conspiring witness is invalid for the entire Torah, the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yosei says: In what case are these matters said? When he conspired in matters of life; but if he conspired in matters of money – he is valid for matters of life.

hebrew_text: נֵימָא: אַבָּיֵי כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר, וְרָבָא כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי? אַבָּיֵי כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר, דְּאָמַר: אָמְרִינַן מִקּוּלָּא לְחוּמְרָא. וְרָבָא דְּאָמַר כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי, דְּאָמַר: מֵחוּמְרָא לְקוּלָּא אָמְרִינַן, מִקּוּלָּא לְחוּמְרָא לָא אָמְרִינַן.
human_translation: Let us say Abaye is in accordance with Rabbi Meir, and Rava is in accordance with Rabbi Yosei. Abaye is in accordance with Rabbi Meir, who says we say from a minor with regard to a major And Rava is in accordance with Rabbi Yosei, who says we say from major with regard to minor we do not say from minor with regard to major
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Neima: Abbayei k'Rabbi Meir, v'Rava k'Rabbi Yosei? Abbayei k'Rabbi Meir, d'amar: Amarinan mi'kulla l'chumra. V'Rava d'amar k'Rabbi Yosei, d'amar: Me'chumra l'kulla amarinan, mi'kulla l'chumra la'amarinan. English translation: Neima: Abbayei is like Rabbi Meir, and Rava is like Rabbi Yosei? Abbayei is like Rabbi Meir, for he said: We say from leniency to stringency. And Rava, who said like Rabbi Yosei, for he said: From stringency to leniency we say, but from leniency to stringency we do not say.

hebrew_text: לָא. אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְלִיגִי, כִּי פְּלִיגִי אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר.
human_translation: No. Everyone agrees according to of Rabbi Yosei When disagree, according to of Rabbi Meir,
llm_translation: Not. In the school of Rabbi Yosei everyone does not disagree, when they disagree in the school of Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: אַבָּיֵי כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר, וְרָבָא: עַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמַר רַבִּי מֵאִיר הָתָם אֶלָּא גַּבֵּי עֵד זוֹמֵם דְּמָמוֹן, דְּרַע לַשָּׁמַיִם וְרַע לַבְּרִיּוֹת. אֲבָל הָכָא, דְּרַע לַשָּׁמַיִם וְאֵין רַע לַבְּרִיּוֹת – לָא.
human_translation: Abaye in accordance with Rabbi Meir, And Rava only there, with regard to a conspiring witness in a monetary Rabbi Meir state that bad toward Heaven, and bad toward people, But here, who is bad toward Heaven but is not bad toward people, not
llm_translation: Abaye is like Rabbi Meir, and Rava: until here did not say Rabbi Meir there except regarding a conspiring witness, whose money is lost, bad for Heaven and bad for creatures. But here, where it is bad for Heaven and not bad for creatures - no.

hebrew_text: וְהִלְכְתָא כְּוָותֵיהּ דְּאַבָּיֵי. וְהָא אִיתּוֹתַב? הָהִיא רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הִיא.
human_translation: And the halakha in accordance with of Abaye. But wasn’t conclusively refuted? That is Rabbi Yosei,
llm_translation: The law is in accordance with the opinion of Abbaye. But is it written? That is the opinion of Rabbi Yosei.

hebrew_text: וְתִיהְוֵי נָמֵי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי? רַבִּי מֵאִיר וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי – הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי!
human_translation: And let it even be Rabbi Yosei. Rabbi Meir and Rabbi Yosei, the halakha in accordance with Rabbi Yosei.
llm_translation: "And it shall be as the opinion of Rabbi Yosei? Rabbi Meir and Rabbi Yosei - the halacha follows Rabbi Yosei!"

hebrew_text: שָׁאנֵי הָתָם, דִּסְתַם לַן תְּנָא כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר. וְהֵיכָא סְתַם לַן?
human_translation: There it is different, as tanna taught us an unattributed in accordance with Rabbi Meir, And where did tanna teach us an unattributed
llm_translation: The difference there is that we anonymously teach like Rabbi Meir. And where do we teach anonymously?

hebrew_text: כִּי הָא דְּבַר חָמָא קְטַל נַפְשָׁא, אֲמַר לֵיהּ רֵישׁ גָּלוּתָא לְרַב אַבָּא בַּר יַעֲקֹב: פּוֹק עַיֵּין בָּהּ, אִי וַדַּאי קְטַל – לִיכְהֲיוּהּ לְעֵינֵיהּ. אֲתוֹ תְּרֵי סָהֲדִי, אַסְהִידוּ בֵּיהּ דְּוַדַּאי קְטַל. אֲזַל אִיהוּ, אַיְיתִי תְּרֵי סָהֲדֵי, אַסְהִידוּ בֵּיהּ בְּחַד מֵהָנָךְ. חַד אָמַר: קַמַּאי דִּידִי גְּנַב קַבָּא דְחוּשְׁלָא, וְחַד אָמַר: קַמַּאי דִּידִי גְּנַב
human_translation: as that which bar Ḥama killed a person. The Exilarch said to Rav Abba bar Ya’akov: Go investigate this if he certainly killed let them put his eyes out. two witnesses came testified that he certainly killed went brought two witnesses, testified about one of those One said: He stole, in my presence, a kav of barley; and one said: He stole, in my presence,
llm_translation: The matter of the hot water that killed a person, Reish Galuta said to Rav Abba bar Yaakov: Go out and investigate it, if it definitely killed – it should be visible to his eyes. Two witnesses came, they testified that it definitely killed. He went, brought two other witnesses, they testified about it from a different angle. One said: "My reeds stole a silver goblet," and one said: "My reeds stole."

hebrew_text: קַתָּא דְבוּרְטְיָא.
human_translation: the handle of a spear [ devortiya ].
llm_translation: The town of Burtia.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַאי דַּעְתָּיךְ? כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר? רַבִּי מֵאִיר וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי – הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי, וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי הָאָמַר: הוּזַם בְּדִינֵי מָמוֹנוֹת – כָּשֵׁר לְדִינֵי נְפָשׁוֹת!
human_translation: said to What do you hold? like Rabbi Meir, Rabbi Meir and Rabbi Yosei, the halakha in accordance with Rabbi Yosei, and doesn’t Rabbi Yosei say was rendered a conspiring witness in monetary law he is fit to capital law?
llm_translation: He said to him: What is your opinion? Like Rabbi Meir? Rabbi Meir and Rabbi Yosei - the halacha is like Rabbi Yosei, and Rabbi Yosei who said: One who is skilled in financial matters is fit for matters of life!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב פַּפֵּי: הָנֵי מִילֵּי הֵיכָא דְּלָא סְתַם לַן תַּנָּא כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר. הָכָא סְתַם לַן תַּנָּא כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר.
human_translation: Rav Pappi said to him: This statement where tanna did not teach us an unattributed in accordance with Rabbi Meir. Here, the tanna taught us an unattributed in accordance with Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Pappai: Those matters where we did not explicitly teach, we follow the opinion of Rabbi Meir. Here, where we explicitly taught, we follow the opinion of Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: מִמַּאי? אִילֵּימָא מֵהָא דִּתְנַן: כׇּל הָרָאוּי לָדוּן דִּינֵי נְפָשׁוֹת רָאוּי לָדוּן דִּינֵי מָמוֹנוֹת. מַנִּי? אִילֵּימָא רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הִיא, הָא אִיכָּא עֵד זוֹמֵם דְּמָמוֹן, דְּכָשֵׁר לְדִינֵי נְפָשׁוֹת וּפָסוּל לְדִינֵי מָמוֹנוֹת! אֶלָּא לָאו, רַבִּי מֵאִיר הִיא.
human_translation: From what If we say from that which we learned Anyone who is fit to adjudicate capital law is fit to adjudicate monetary law, Whose If we say it is Rabbi Yosei, isn’t there a conspiring witness in monetary matters, who is fit to capital law but is disqualified from monetary law? Rather, is not Rabbi Meir?
llm_translation: From what source? If you say from that which we learned: "Anyone fit to be judged for matters of life and death is fit to be judged for monetary matters." Who is the authority? If you say it is Rabbi Yosei, but there is a conspiring witness regarding money, who is valid for matters of life and death but invalid for monetary matters! Rather, it is not so; it is Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: מִמַּאי? דִּילְמָא בִּפְסוּלֵי יוּחֲסִין קָאֵי!
human_translation: from where Perhaps referring to disqualified lineage,
llm_translation: From what? Perhaps it stands on the disqualifications of lineage!

hebrew_text: דְּאִי לָא תֵּימָא הָכִי, סֵיפָא דְּקָתָנֵי: יֵשׁ רָאוּי לָדוּן דִּינֵי מָמוֹנוֹת וְאֵין רָאוּי לָדוּן דִּינֵי נְפָשׁוֹת, אַמַּאי אֵינוֹ רָאוּי? דְּאִיתַּזַּם בְּדִינֵי נְפָשׁוֹת רָאוּי לָדוּן דִּינֵי מָמוֹנוֹת? וְהָא דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל פָּסוּל הוּא! אֶלָּא בִּפְסוּל יוּחֲסִין קָאֵי. הָכָא נָמֵי בִּפְסוּל יוּחֲסִין קָאֵי.
human_translation: As, if you do not say so, the latter clause which teaches: There is fit to adjudicate monetary law but is unfit to adjudicate capital law, Why unfit who was rendered a conspiring witness in capital law, fit to adjudicate monetary law? But doesn’t everyone agree he is disqualified? Rather, referring to disqualified lineage. Here too, referring to disqualified lineage.
llm_translation: If you don't say so, the latter part of what is taught: There is one fit to judge monetary cases but unfit to judge capital cases, why is he unfit? Because if he has been disqualified in capital cases, is he fit to judge monetary cases? But this applies to all cases of disqualification! Rather, he stands in relation to a disqualification. Here too, he stands in relation to a disqualification.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, הָכָא קָא סָתַם לַן תְּנָא, דִּתְנַן: אֵלּוּ הֵן הַפְּסוּלִים – הַמְשַׂחֵק בְּקוּבְיָא, וּמַלְוֵי בְּרִבִּית, וּמַפְרִיחֵי יוֹנִים, וְסוֹחֲרֵי שְׁבִיעִית, וְהָעֲבָדִים. זֶה הַכְּלָל: כׇּל עֵדוּת שֶׁאֵין הָאִשָּׁה כְּשֵׁירָה לָהּ, אַף הֵן אֵין כְּשֵׁירִין לָהּ.
human_translation: Rather, the tanna taught us an unattributed here, as we learned These are disqualified One who plays with dice, and those who lend with interest, and those who fly pigeons, and merchants Sabbatical And slaves This is the principle: any testimony for which a woman is not fit, these too are not fit.
llm_translation: Rather, here it is taught to us by a Tanna, as we have learned: These are the disqualified individuals - one who plays with dice, and one who lends with interest, and pigeon flyers, and traders of the Sabbatical year produce, and slaves. This is the general principle: any testimony that a woman is not fit to receive, they are also not fit to give.

hebrew_text: מַנִּי? אִילֵּימָא רַבִּי יוֹסֵי – וְהָאִיכָּא עֵדוּת בְּדִינֵי נְפָשׁוֹת, שֶׁאֵין הָאִשָּׁה כְּשֵׁרָה לָהּ, וְהֵן כְּשֵׁרִין לַהּ? אֶלָּא לָאו רַבִּי מֵאִיר הִיא!
human_translation: whose If we say Rabbi Yosei, But isn’t there testimony in capital law, for which a woman is not fit but for which are fit? Rather, is it not Rabbi Meir,
llm_translation: Who is this? Perhaps Rabbi Yosei - but is there testimony in cases of capital punishment, where a woman is not fit for her, yet they are fit for her? Rather, it is not Rabbi Meir!

hebrew_text: קָם בַּר חָמָא, נַשְּׁקֵיהּ אַכַּרְעֵיהּ, וְקַבְּלֵיהּ לִכְרָגֵיהּ דְּכוּלֵּי שְׁנֵיהּ.
human_translation: Bar Ḥama arose and kissed on his feet and accepted to his tax [ karga ] for all of his years.
llm_translation: Bar Ḥama stood up, kissed his feet, and accepted upon himself the reproof of both of them.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ וְאֵלּוּ הֵן הַקְּרוֹבִין: אָחִיו, וַאֲחִי אָבִיו, וַאֲחִי אִמּוֹ, וּבַעַל אֲחוֹתוֹ, וּבַעַל אֲחוֹת אָבִיו, וּבַעַל אֲחוֹת אִמּוֹ, וּבַעַל אִמּוֹ, וְחָמִיו, וְגִיסוֹ. הֵן וּבְנֵיהֶן וְחַתְנֵיהֶן, וְחוֹרְגוֹ לְבַדּוֹ.
human_translation: And these are relatives brother, and his paternal uncle, and his maternal uncle, and his sister’s husband, and the husband of his paternal aunt, and the husband of his maternal aunt, and his mother’s husband, and his father-in-law, and his brother-in-law, They and their sons, and their sons-in-law And his stepson alone
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: And these are the close relatives: his brother, and his father's brother, and his mother's brother, and the husband of his sister, and the husband of his father's sister, and the husband of his mother's sister, and his mother's husband, and his father-in-law, and his son-in-law, and his brother-in-law. They, their sons, and their sons-in-law, and his brother-in-law alone.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: זוֹ מִשְׁנַת רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, אֲבָל מִשְׁנָה רִאשׁוֹנָה – דּוֹדוֹ וּבֶן דּוֹדוֹ וְכׇל הָרָאוּי לְיוֹרְשׁוֹ, וְכׇל הַקָּרוֹב לוֹ בְּאוֹתָהּ שָׁעָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: This is Rabbi Akiva’s mishna. But the initial mishna His uncle and the son of his uncle, and anyone who is fit to inherit him. And anyone who is related to him at the time
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei said: This is from the teaching of Rabbi Akiva, but the first teaching - his uncle and his cousin and all fitting to inherit him, and all close to him at that time.

hebrew_text: הָיָה קָרוֹב וְנִתְרַחֵק, הֲרֵי זֶה כָּשֵׁר. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אֲפִילּוּ מֵתָה בִּתּוֹ וְיֵשׁ לוֹ בָּנִים מִמֶּנָּה, הֲרֵי זֶה קָרוֹב.
human_translation: was a relative and became unrelated he is fit. Rabbi Yehuda says: Even if his daughter died but has children from her, he is a relative;
llm_translation: He was close and moved away, this is valid. Rabbi Yehuda says: Even if his daughter died and he has children from her, he is close.

hebrew_text: הָאוֹהֵב וְהַשּׂוֹנֵא. אוֹהֵב – זֶה שׁוֹשְׁבִינוֹ. שׂוֹנֵא – כֹּל שֶׁלֹּא דִּבֵּר עִמּוֹ שְׁלֹשָׁה יָמִים בְּאֵיבָה. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: לֹא נֶחְשְׁדוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל עַל כָּךְ.
human_translation: One who loves or one who hates loves this his groomsman. hates anyone who, out of enmity, did not speak with three days. said to The Jewish people are not suspected of
llm_translation: Beloved and hated. Beloved - this is one who dwells with him. Hated - anyone who has not spoken with him for three days out of enmity. They said to him: The Israelites did not suspect you of this.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מְנָהָנֵי מִילֵּי? דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״לֹא יוּמְתוּ אָבוֹת עַל בָּנִים״. מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר? אִם לְלַמֵּד שֶׁלֹּא יוּמְתוּ אָבוֹת בַּעֲוֹן בָּנִים וּבָנִים בַּעֲוֹן אָבוֹת, הֲרֵי כְּבָר נֶאֱמַר: ״אִישׁ בְּחֶטְאוֹ יוּמָתוּ״.
human_translation: From where is this matter, as the Sages taught “The fathers shall not be put to death for the children, Why the verse state If to teach that the fathers shall not be put to death for the sin of the children, nor the children for the sin of the fathers, it is in any event stated: “Every man shall be put to death for his own sin.”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara: What is the meaning of the verse, as the Rabbis taught: "Fathers shall not be put to death because of children"? What does the Talmud teach us? If to teach that fathers shall not be put to death for the sin of their children, and children shall not be put to death for the sin of their fathers, it has already been stated: "Each man shall be put to death for his own sin."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, ״לֹא יוּמְתוּ אָבוֹת עַל בָּנִים״ – בְּעֵדוּת בָּנִים, ״וּבָנִים לֹא יוּמְתוּ עַל אָבוֹת״ – בְּעֵדוּת אָבוֹת.
human_translation: Rather, “The fathers shall not be put to death for the children” by the testimony of the children, “Neither shall the children be put to death for the fathers” by the testimony of the fathers.
llm_translation: Rather, "Fathers shall not be put to death because of children" - by the testimony of children, "and children shall not be put to death because of fathers" - by the testimony of fathers.

hebrew_text: וּבָנִים בַּעֲוֹן אָבוֹת לָא? וְהָכְתִיב: ״פֹּקֵד עֲוֹן אָבוֹת עַל בָּנִים״!
human_translation: And are children not for the sin of the fathers? But isn’t it written: “Visiting the iniquity of the fathers upon the children,
llm_translation: Sons for the iniquity of fathers not? And it is written: "Visiting the iniquity of fathers upon children"!

hebrew_text: הָתָם, כְּשֶׁאוֹחֲזִין מַעֲשֵׂה אֲבוֹתֵיהֶן בִּידֵיהֶן.
human_translation: There, where adopt the actions of their ancestors as their own.
llm_translation: There, when they grasp the deeds of their forefathers in their hands.

hebrew_text: כִּדְתַנְיָא: ״וְאַף בַּעֲוֹנֹת אֲבֹתָם אִתָּם יִמָּקּוּ״ – כְּשֶׁאוֹחֲזִין מַעֲשֵׂה אֲבוֹתֵיהֶם בִּידֵיהֶם. אַתָּה אוֹמֵר כְּשֶׁאוֹחֲזִין, אוֹ אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא כְּשֶׁאֵין אוֹחֲזִין? כְּשֶׁהוּא אוֹמֵר ״אִישׁ בְּחֶטְאוֹ יוּמָתוּ״, הֲרֵי כְּשֶׁאוֹחֲזִין מַעֲשֵׂה אֲבוֹתֵיהֶן בִּידֵיהֶן.
human_translation: as it is taught “And also in the iniquities of their fathers shall they pine away with them” where they adopt the actions of their ancestors as their own. you say where they adopt or where they do not adopt When states: “Every man shall be put to death for his own sin,” where they adopt the actions of their ancestors as their own.
llm_translation: As it was taught: "And for the iniquities of their fathers, they shall be with them" - when they hold the deeds of their fathers in their hands. You say when they hold, or is it only when they do not hold? When it says, "Each man shall die for his own sin," behold, when they hold the deeds of their fathers in their hands.

hebrew_text: וְלָא? וְהָכְתִיב: ״וְכָשְׁלוּ אִישׁ בְּאָחִיו״ – אִישׁ בַּעֲוֹן אָחִיו, מְלַמֵּד שֶׁכּוּלָּן עֲרֵבִים זֶה בָּזֶה.
human_translation: And not But isn’t it written: “And they shall stumble one upon another” one due to the iniquity of another, teaches that all guarantors, for one another.
llm_translation: "And not? And it is written: 'And when a man stumbles with his brother' - a man in the sin of his brother, teaching that their fate is intertwined with one another."

hebrew_text: הָתָם, שֶׁהָיָה בְּיָדָם לִמְחוֹת וְלֹא מִיחוּ.
human_translation: There, where had the ability to protest but they did not protest.
llm_translation: There, that he was in their hand to erase and did not erase.

hebrew_text: אַשְׁכְּחַן אָבוֹת לְבָנִים, וּבָנִים לְאָבוֹת.
human_translation: we found fathers about children and children about fathers
llm_translation: I have found fathers for sons, and sons for fathers.

hebrew_text: וְכׇל שֶׁכֵּן אָבוֹת לַהֲדָדֵי.
human_translation: And all the more so, fathers, about each other,
llm_translation: And all the more so, Avot for Hadadei.

hebrew_text: בָּנִים לְבָנִים – מְנָלַן?
human_translation: from where do we children about children
llm_translation: Sons to sons - from where?

hebrew_text: אִם כֵּן, לִיכְתּוֹב קְרָא: ״לֹא יוּמְתוּ אָבוֹת עַל בֵּן״! מַאי ״בָּנִים״? דַּאֲפִילּוּ בָּנִים לַהֲדָדֵי.
human_translation: If so, let the verse write: The fathers shall not be put to death for the child. what “children” that even children about each other.
llm_translation: If so, let it be written: "Fathers shall not be put to death because of sons"! What is "sons"? Even sons of Hadadezer.

hebrew_text: אַשְׁכְּחַן בָּנִים לַהֲדָדֵי, בָּנִים לְעָלְמָא מְנָלַן?
human_translation: We found children about each other. From where do we children about others?
llm_translation: We find children for Hadadei, children for the world, from where?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָמֵי בַּר חָמָא: סְבָרָא הוּא, כִּדְתַנְיָא: אֵין הָעֵדִים נַעֲשִׂין זוֹמְמִין עַד שֶׁיִּזּוֹמּוּ שְׁנֵיהֶן. וְאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ בָּנִים לְעָלְמָא כְּשֵׁרִין, נִמְצָא עֵד זוֹמֵם נֶהֱרָג בְּעֵדוּת אָחִיו.
human_translation: Rami bar Ḥama says: is logical reasoning, as it is taught The witnesses are not rendered conspiring unless they are both rendered conspiring And if it enters your mind children are fit about others, a conspiring witness found to be executed based on the testimony of his brother,
llm_translation: Ramei bar Ḥama said: It is a logical deduction, as it is taught: Witnesses are not considered conspirators until both of them conspire. And if, according to your opinion, children are valid witnesses forever, it would be found that a witness who conspires is put to death based on the testimony of his brother.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא: וְלִיטַעְמָיךְ, הָא דִּתְנַן: שְׁלֹשָׁה אַחִין וְאֶחָד מִצְטָרֵף עִמָּהֶן – הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ שָׁלֹשׁ עֵדִיּוֹת, וְהֵן עֵדוּת אַחַת לַהֲזָמָה.
human_translation: Rava said to him: But according to your reasoning, that which we learned three brothers and one joins with these are three testimonies But they are one testimony for conspiring
llm_translation: He said to him Rava: And to taste you, this that we learned: Three brothers and one joins with them - these are three testimonies, and they are one testimony for conspiracy.

hebrew_text: נִמְצָא עֵד זוֹמֵם מְשַׁלֵּם מָמוֹן בְּעֵדוּת אָחִיו.
human_translation: a conspiring witness found paying money due to the testimony of his brother,
llm_translation: Found witness zomem pays money in testimony his brother.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, הֲזָמָה מֵעָלְמָא קָאָתֵי. הָכָא נָמֵי, הֲזָמָה מֵעָלְמָא קָאָתֵי.
human_translation: Rather, rendering a conspiring witness comes from others, Here too, rendering a conspiring witness comes from others.
llm_translation: Rather, conspiracy comes from the world. Here too, conspiracy comes from the world.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, אִם כֵּן לִיכְתּוֹב קְרָא ״וּבֵן עַל אָבוֹת״, אִי נָמֵי ״הֵם עַל אָבוֹת״. מַאי ״וּבָנִים״? אֲפִילּוּ בָּנִים לְעָלְמָא.
human_translation: Rather, If so let the verse write: And a child for the fathers, or: They for the fathers. what “and the children” children even about others.
llm_translation: Rather, if so, it should have been written in the verse "and son upon fathers," rather than "they upon fathers." What is "and sons"? Even sons for eternity.

hebrew_text: אַשְׁכְּחַן קְרוֹבֵי הָאָב, קְרוֹבֵי הָאֵם מְנָלַן? אָמַר קְרָא: ״אָבוֹת״ ״אָבוֹת״ תְּרֵי זִימְנֵי. אִם אֵינוֹ עִנְיָן לִקְרוֹבֵי הָאָב, תְּנֵיהוּ עִנְיָן לִקְרוֹבֵי הָאֵם.
human_translation: We found paternal relatives. From where do we maternal relatives? The verse states “fathers,” “fathers,” twice. If is not matter of paternal relatives, apply it matter of maternal relatives.
llm_translation: I have found that relatives of the father are close, how do we know that relatives of the mother are close? The verse says: "ancestors" "ancestors" twice. If it is not a matter for relatives of the father, it is a matter for relatives of the mother.

hebrew_text: אַשְׁכְּחַן לְחוֹבָה, לִזְכוּת מְנָא לַן?
human_translation: We found to detriment From where do we to benefit
llm_translation: We have found a liability, how do we find merit for ourselves?

hebrew_text: אָמַר קְרָא: ״יוּמְתוּ״, ״יוּמְתוּ״ – תְּרֵי זִימְנֵי. אִם אֵינוֹ עִנְיָן לְחוֹבָה, תְּנֵהוּ עִנְיָן לִזְכוּת.
human_translation: The verse states “shall be put to death,” “shall be put to death,” twice. If is not matter to detriment apply it matter of to benefit
llm_translation: The verse said: "They shall surely die," "They shall surely die" - two times. If it is not relevant for liability, attribute it to merit.

hebrew_text: אַשְׁכְּחַן בְּדִינֵי נְפָשׁוֹת, בְּדִינֵי מָמוֹנוֹת מְנָלַן?
human_translation: We found in capital law, From where do we in monetary law?
llm_translation: We find in matters of life, how do we derive laws from matters of monetary cases?

hebrew_text: אָמַר קְרָא: ״מִשְׁפַּט אֶחָד יִהְיֶה לָכֶם״ – מִשְׁפָּט הַשָּׁוֶה לָכֶם.
human_translation: the verse states: “You shall have one manner of law” A law that is equal for you.
llm_translation: The verse says: "One law shall be for you" - the law that is equal for you.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב: אֲחִי אַבָּא לֹא יָעִיד לִי, הוּא וּבְנוֹ וַחֲתָנוֹ. אַף אֲנִי לֹא אָעִיד לוֹ, אֲנִי וּבְנִי וַחֲתָנִי.
human_translation: Rav says: My paternal uncle will not testify about me, he, nor his son, nor his son-in-law, Furthermore, I will not testify about him, I, nor my son, nor my son-in-law.
llm_translation: Rav said: "My brother, Abba, will not testify for me, neither he nor his son nor his son-in-law. Likewise, I will not testify for him, neither I nor my son nor my son-in-law."

hebrew_text: וְאַמַּאי? הָוֵה לֵיהּ שְׁלִישִׁי בְּרִאשׁוֹן, וַאֲנַן שֵׁנִי בְּשֵׁנִי תְּנַן, שְׁנֵי בְּרִאשׁוֹן תְּנַן, שְׁלִישִׁי בְּרִאשׁוֹן לָא תְּנַן!
human_translation: And why, it is third with regard to first And we learned second about second We learned second about first we did not learn third about first
llm_translation: And why? He was third in the first, and we are second in the second, we learned, two in the first we learned, third in the first we did not learn!

hebrew_text: מַאי ״חֲתָנוֹ״ דְּקָתָנֵי בְּמַתְנִיתִין? חֲתַן בְּנוֹ.
human_translation: that is taught in the mishna: what his son-in-law the son-in-law of his son.
llm_translation: What is the "chatano" that is taught in the Mishnah? A chatan is his son.

hebrew_text: וְלִיתְנֵי ״בֶּן בְּנוֹ״!
human_translation: But let teach: the son of his son,
llm_translation: And it was taught: "Ben Beno"!

hebrew_text: מִילְּתָא אַגַּב אוֹרְחֵיהּ קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן, דְּבַעַל כְּאִשְׁתּוֹ.
human_translation: teaches us a matter in passing: That a husband is like his wife.
llm_translation: The matter in relation to his wife he heard from his fellow travelers, that a husband is like his wife.
