hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא הָא דְתָנֵי רַבִּי חִיָּיא: שְׁמוֹנָה אָבוֹת, שֶׁהֵן עֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבָּעָה – הָנֵי תְּלָתִין וְתַרְתֵּין הָוֵי!
human_translation: But that which Rabbi Ḥiyya teaches Eight fathers, which are twenty-four these are thirty-two,
llm_translation: And rather, this that Rabbi Ḥiyya teaches: "The Eight Fathers, which are twenty-four - these are thirty-two!"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, לְעוֹלָם חֲתָנוֹ מַמָּשׁ. וְאַמַּאי קָרֵי לֵיהּ ״חֲתַן בְּנוֹ״? כֵּיוָן דְּמֵעָלְמָא קָאָתֵי, כְּדוֹר אַחֵר דָּמֵי.
human_translation: Rather, in fact his actual son-in-law. And why does refer to him as the son-in-law of his son, Since comes from outside as if another generation.
llm_translation: Rather, indeed, his actual son-in-law. And why is he called "son-in-law"? Since he stands in the world, he is considered like another generation.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, הָוֵה לֵיהּ שְׁלִישִׁי בְּשֵׁנִי, וְרַב אַכְשַׁר שְׁלִישִׁי בְּשֵׁנִי.
human_translation: If that is so, is to third with regard to second And Rav deemed third fit about second
llm_translation: If so, he would have a third in the second, and Rav validates a third in the second.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא רַב דְּאָמַר כְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר. דְּתַנְיָא: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר, כְּשֵׁם שֶׁאֲחִי אַבָּא לֹא יָעִיד לִי – הוּא וּבְנוֹ וַחֲתָנוֹ, כָּךְ בֶּן אֲחִי אַבָּא לֹא יָעִיד לִי – הוּא וּבְנוֹ וַחֲתָנוֹ.
human_translation: Rather, Rav stated in accordance with Rabbi Elazar, as it is taught Rabbi Elazar says: Just as my paternal uncle will not testify about me, he, nor his son, nor his son-in-law, so too, the son of my paternal uncle will not testify about me, he, nor his son, nor his son-in-law.
llm_translation: Rather, Rav said as Rabbi Elazar said. As it was taught: Rabbi Elazar says, just as my father's brother cannot testify for me - he, his son, and his son-in-law, so too my father's brother's son cannot testify for me - he, his son, and his son-in-law.

hebrew_text: וְאַכַּתִּי הָוֵה לֵיהּ שְׁלִישִׁי בְּשֵׁנִי, וְרַב אַכְשַׁר שְׁלִישִׁי בְּשֵׁנִי.
human_translation: But still, is third about second and Rav deemed third fit about second
llm_translation: And once he was the third in the second, and Rav validates the third in the second.

hebrew_text: רַב סָבַר לֵיהּ כְּוָותֵיהּ בַּחֲדָא, וּפְלִיג עֲלֵיהּ בַּחֲדָא.
human_translation: Rav holds in accordance with in one and he disagrees with him in one
llm_translation: Rav holds according to his opinion in one matter, and disagrees with him in another matter.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַב? דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״לֹא יוּמְתוּ אָבוֹת עַל בָּנִים וּבָנִים״, לְרַבּוֹת דּוֹר אַחֵר.
human_translation: What is the reason of Rav? as the verse states: “The fathers shall not be put to death for the children, and the children to include another generation,
llm_translation: What is the reason for Rav's opinion? As the verse states: "Fathers shall not be put to death because of children, and children," to include another generation.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, ״עַל בָּנִים״ אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא: פְּסוּלֵי דְאָבוֹת שְׁדִי אַבָּנִים.
human_translation: And Rabbi Elazar the Merciful One states: “For the children,” the ones disqualified about the fathers cast on the children
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said, "Regarding children," the Merciful One said: "The offspring of fathers shall be stoned."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: אֲחִי חֲמוֹתִי לֹא יָעִיד לִי, בֶּן אֲחִי חֲמוֹתִי לֹא יָעִיד לִי, בֶּן אֲחוֹת חֲמוֹתִי לֹא יָעִיד לִי. וּתְנָא תּוּנָא: בַּעַל אֲחוֹתוֹ, וּבַעַל אֲחוֹת אָבִיו, וּבַעַל אֲחוֹת אִמּוֹ, הֵן וּבְנֵיהֶן וְחַתְנֵיהֶן.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman says: The brother of my mother-in-law will not testify about me; the son of the brother of my mother-in-law will not testify about me; the son of the sister of my mother-in-law will not testify about me. And the tanna taught His sister’s husband, and the husband of his father’s sister, and the husband of his mother’s sister, they and their sons, and their sons-in-law.
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said: "My brother-in-law cannot testify for me, my nephew cannot testify for me, my brother-in-law's son cannot testify for me." And it was taught in a Baraita: "The husband of his sister, the husband of his father's sister, and the husband of his mother's sister, they and their sons and sons-in-law."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: כִּי הֲוֵינַן בֵּי עוּלָּא, אִיבְּעִי לַן: אֲחִי חָמִיו מַהוּ? בֶּן אֲחִי חָמִיו מַהוּ? בֶּן אֲחוֹת חָמִיו מַהוּ?
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: When we were in Ulla’s study hall, we were asked: the brother of father-in-law, what is the son of the brother of father-in-law, what is the son of the sister of father-in-law, what is
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said: When we were in the house of Ulla, he asked us: What is the status of one's paternal uncle? What is the status of one's cousin? What is the status of one's maternal cousin?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לַן: תְּנֵיתוּהָ, אָחִיו וַאֲחִי אָבִיו וַאֲחִי אִמּוֹ – הֵן וּבְנֵיהֶן וְחַתְנֵיהֶן.
human_translation: said to us: You learned His brother, and his paternal uncle, and his maternal uncle, they and their sons, and their sons-in-law.
llm_translation: He said to us: "Her sister, and the brother of her father, and the brother of her mother - they and their children and their sons-in-law."

hebrew_text: רַב אִיקְּלַע לְמִזְבַּן
human_translation: Rav arrived to buy
llm_translation: Rav Iklah came to Mizban.

hebrew_text: גְּוִילֵי. בְּעוֹ מִינֵּיהּ: מַהוּ שֶׁיָּעִיד אָדָם בְּאֵשֶׁת חוֹרְגוֹ?
human_translation: scrolls They asked of him What is whether a man can testify with regard to the wife of his stepson?
llm_translation: "Geveilei. Be'o minei: Mahu sheya'id adam be'eshet chorgo?" "Rolls. In what case? What is the law if a man testifies regarding his weaver's wife?"

hebrew_text: בְּסוּרָא אָמְרִי: בַּעַל כְּאִשְׁתּוֹ.
human_translation: In Sura they say A husband is like his wife.
llm_translation: In Sura they say: "A husband with his wife."

hebrew_text: בְּפוּמְבְּדִיתָא אָמְרִי: אִשָּׁה כְּבַעְלָהּ. דְּאָמַר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: מִנַּיִין שֶׁהָאִשָּׁה כְּבַעְלָהּ? דִּכְתִיב: ״עֶרְוַת אֲחִי אָבִיךָ לֹא תְגַלֵּה אֶל אִשְׁתּוֹ לֹא תִקְרָב דֹּדָתְךָ הִיא״. וַהֲלֹא אֵשֶׁת דּוֹדוֹ הִיא! מִכְּלָל דְּאִשָּׁה כְּבַעְלָהּ.
human_translation: In Pumbedita they say A wife is like her husband. As Rav Huna says Rav Naḥman says: From where that a wife is like her husband? As it is written: “You shall not uncover the nakedness of your father’s brother; you shall not approach his wife: She is your aunt” Isn’t she the wife of his uncle, by inference, a wife is like her husband.
llm_translation: In the town of Pumbedita they said: A woman is like her husband. For Rav Huna said in the name of Rav Nachman: From where do we derive that a woman is like her husband? As it is written: "The nakedness of your father's brother you shall not uncover; you shall not approach his wife; she is your aunt." But is not the wife of one's uncle herself! From this we can infer that a woman is like her husband.

hebrew_text: וּבַעַל אִמּוֹ, הוּא וּבְנוֹ וַחֲתָנוֹ. בְּנוֹ – הַיְינוּ אָחִיו?
human_translation: his mother’s husband, he, and his son, and his son-in-law. The son of is his brother,
llm_translation: And the husband of his mother, he and his son and his son-in-law. His son - is that his brother?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה: לֹא נִצְרְכָה אֶלָּא לַאֲחִי הָאָח.
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya said: is necessary only for the brother of the brother,
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yirmeya: "It was only needed for the brother of the brother."

hebrew_text: רַב חִסְדָּא אַכְשַׁר בַּאֲחִי הָאָח. אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: לָא שְׁמִיעַ לָךְ הָא דְּרַבִּי יִרְמְיָה? אֲמַר לְהוּ: לָא שְׁמִיעַ לִי, כְּלוֹמַר, לָא סְבִירָא לִי.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda deemed the brother of the brother fit. said to him: Did you not hear this of Rabbi Yirmeya, said to them: I did not hear as if to say: I do not hold
llm_translation: Rav Chisda said: "Achshar in the brother of the brother." They said to him: "Don't you hear what Rabbi Yirmeya said?" He said to them: "I did not hear, meaning, I do not agree."

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, הַיְינוּ אָחִיו! תְּנָא אָחִיו מִן הָאָב, וְקָתָנֵי אָחִיו מִן הָאֵם.
human_translation: If so, is his brother. taught a paternal brother, and teaches a maternal brother.
llm_translation: If so, that is his brother! A Tanna taught: His brother from the father, and it is taught: His brother from the mother.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: אֲבִי חָתָן וַאֲבִי כַּלָּה מְעִידִין זֶה עַל זֶה, וְלָא דָּמוּ לַהֲדָדֵי אֶלָּא כִּי אַכְלָא לְדַנָּא.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda says: The father of groom and the father of bride can testify about each other, and they are considered to each other only like a lid on a barrel,
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: The father of the groom and the father of the bride testify for one another, and they are not considered like Hadadei, but rather like judges.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה: מֵעִיד אָדָם לְאִשְׁתּוֹ אֲרוּסָה. אָמַר רָבִינָא: לָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא לְאַפּוֹקֵי מִינַּהּ, אֲבָל לְעַיּוֹלֵי לַהּ – לָא מְהֵימַן.
human_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana says: A man can testify about his betrothed wife; Ravina says: We said only for removes from her but for awards her not deemed credible,
llm_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said: A man may testify for his betrothed wife. Ravina said: We only said this for the purpose of removing her from the marriage, but to establish her in the marriage - we do not trust his testimony.

hebrew_text: וְלָא הִיא, לָא שְׁנָא לְאַפּוֹקֵי וְלָא שְׁנָא לְעַיּוֹלֵי – לָא מְהֵימַן.
human_translation: But is not so. is no difference removes and is no difference awards not deemed credible.
llm_translation: And not it, not differs to apukai and not differs to ayyolei - not trusted.

hebrew_text: מַאי דַּעְתָּיךְ? כִּדְאָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַמֵּי מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּעוּלָּא: אִשְׁתּוֹ אֲרוּסָה לֹא אוֹנֵן וְלֹא מִטַּמֵּא לַהּ, וְכֵן הִיא לֹא אוֹנֶנֶת וְלֹא מִטַּמְּאָה לוֹ. מֵתָה – אֵינוֹ יוֹרְשָׁהּ, מֵת הוּא – גּוֹבָה כְּתוּבָּתָהּ.
human_translation: What is your thinking as Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Ami said in the name of Ulla: One does not acute mourning of his betrothed wife, nor may he become ritually impure to her Similarly, she does not acute mourning for him and not become ritually impure to him. she dies, he does not inherit her he dies, she collects her marriage contract
llm_translation: What is your opinion? Like Rabbi Chiya bar Ami said in the name of Ulla: A man's betrothed wife neither mourns nor becomes impure for him, and likewise, he does not mourn nor become impure for her. If she dies, he does not inherit her; if he dies, her marriage contract is collected.

hebrew_text: הָתָם, בִּשְׁאֵרוֹ תְּלָה רַחֲמָנָא, אַכַּתִּי לָאו שְׁאֵרוֹ הִיא. הָכָא, מִשּׁוּם אִיקָּרוֹבֵי דַּעְתָּא הוּא, וְהָא אִיקָּרַבָא דַּעְתֵּיהּ לְגַבַּהּ.
human_translation: there, the Merciful One renders it dependent on “his kin” is not yet his kin, here, it is due to a sense of affinity and feels a sense of affinity toward
llm_translation: There, in its other part, hangs the Merciful One, for it is not its other part. Here, due to the closeness of his mind, and there, the closeness of her mind is to the high.

hebrew_text: חוֹרְגוֹ לְבַדּוֹ. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: חוֹרְגוֹ לְבַדּוֹ. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: גִּיסוֹ. וְתַנְיָא אִידַּךְ: גִּיסוֹ לְבַדּוֹ. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: חוֹרְגוֹ.
human_translation: his stepson alone The Sages taught His stepson alone Rabbi Yosei says: His brother-in-law. And it is taught another His brother-in-law alone Rabbi Yehuda says: His stepson.
llm_translation: He weaves alone. The Rabbis taught: He weaves alone. Rabbi Yosei says: His reed. And it was taught in another Baraita: His reed alone. Rabbi Yehuda says: He weaves.

hebrew_text: מַאי קָאָמַר? אִילֵּימָא הָכִי קָאָמַר: חוֹרְגוֹ לְבַדּוֹ, וְהוּא הַדִּין לְגִיסוֹ. וַאֲתָא רַבִּי יוֹסֵי לְמֵימַר: גִּיסוֹ לְבַדּוֹ, וְהוּא הַדִּין לְחוֹרְגוֹ. אֶלָּא מַתְנִיתִין דְּקָתָנֵי: גִּיסוֹ הוּא וּבְנוֹ וַחֲתָנוֹ, מַנִּי? לָא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה וְלָא רַבִּי יוֹסֵי.
human_translation: What is saying? If we say this is saying: His stepson alone and the same is true with regard to his brother-in-law, and Rabbi Yosei comes to say his brother-in-law alone and the same is true with regard to his stepson; whose is the mishna, which teaches his brother-in-law he and his son, and his son-in-law? neither Rabbi Yehuda nor Rabbi Yosei,
llm_translation: What is it saying? If so he is saying: He plows alone, and the same for his reaping. And Rabbi Yosei came to say: His reaping alone, and the same for his plowing. Rather, the Mishnah teaches: His reaping, and his son, and his son-in-law, who is it? Not Rabbi Yehuda and not Rabbi Yosei.

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא הָכִי קָאָמַר: חוֹרְגוֹ לְבַדּוֹ, אֲבָל גִּיסוֹ – הוּא וּבְנוֹ וַחֲתָנוֹ. וַאֲתָא רַבִּי יוֹסֵי לְמֵימַר: גִּיסוֹ לְבַדּוֹ, אֲבָל חוֹרְגוֹ – הוּא וּבְנוֹ וַחֲתָנוֹ.
human_translation: Rather, this is saying: His stepson alone but his brother-in-law, he and his son, and his son-in-law And Rabbi Yosei comes to say his brother-in-law alone but his stepson, he and his son, and his son-in-law
llm_translation: And rather thus he said: One who plows alone, but his son - he and his son and his son-in-law. And Rabbi Yosei came to say: His son alone, but he who plows - he and his son and his son-in-law.

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא, הָא דְתָנֵי רַבִּי חִיָּיא: שְׁמוֹנָה אָבוֹת, שֶׁהֵן עֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבָּעָה, כְּמַאן? לָא כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי וְלָא כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה!
human_translation: But in accordance with whose is that Rabbi Ḥiyya teaches, eight fathers, which are twenty-four neither in accordance with Rabbi Yosei nor in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: And rather, this that Rabbi Ḥiyya taught: The Eight Fathers, which are twenty-four, according to whom? Not like Rabbi Yosei and not like Rabbi Yehuda!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא הָכִי קָאָמַר: חוֹרְגוֹ לְבַדּוֹ, אֲבָל גִּיסוֹ – הוּא וּבְנוֹ וַחֲתָנוֹ. וַאֲתָא רַבִּי יוֹסֵי לְמֵימַר: גִּיסוֹ לְבַדּוֹ, וְכׇל שֶׁכֵּן חוֹרְגוֹ. וּמַתְנִיתִין – רַבִּי יְהוּדָה, בָּרַיְיתָא – רַבִּי יוֹסֵי.
human_translation: Rather, this is saying: His stepson alone but his brother-in-law, he and his son, and his son-in-law And Rabbi Yosei comes to say his brother-in-law alone and all the more so his stepson. And the mishna Rabbi Yehuda, baraita Rabbi Yosei.
llm_translation: Rather, thus he said: His father-in-law alone, but his son-in-law - he and his son and his son-in-law. And Rabbi Yosei came to say: His son-in-law alone, and certainly his father-in-law. And in the Mishnah - Rabbi Yehuda, in the Baraita - Rabbi Yosei.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: halakha in accordance with Rabbi Yosei.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yosei.

hebrew_text: הָהִיא מַתַּנְתָּא דַּהֲווֹ חֲתִימִי עֲלַהּ תְּרֵי גִּיסֵי, סְבַר רַב יוֹסֵף לְאַכְשׁוֹרַהּ, דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי.
human_translation: a certain gift on which two brothers-in-law were signed. Rav Yosef thought to deem it valid, as Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: halakha in accordance with Rabbi Yosei.
llm_translation: That Mishnah where there were two bundles of grain, Rav Yosef thought to tie it, as Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: The halakha is like Rabbi Yosei.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: מִמַּאי דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי דְּמַתְנִיתִין, דְּמַכְשַׁר בְּגִיסוֹ? דִּילְמָא רַבִּי יוֹסֵי דְּבָרַיְיתָא, דְּפָסֵיל בְּגִיסוֹ?
human_translation: Abaye said to him: From where that Rabbi Yosei in the mishna, who deems brother-in-law fit Perhaps Rabbi Yosei in the baraita , who deems brother-in-law, disqualified?
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: From what source is it known regarding Rabbi Yosei of the Mishnah, that he validates a vessel with its rim? Perhaps Rabbi Yosei follows the words of the Torah, which disqualifies a vessel with its rim?

hebrew_text: לָא סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ, דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: כְּגוֹן אֲנָא וּפִנְחָס דְּהָוֵינַן אֲחֵי וְגִיסֵי, אֲבָל גִּיסֵי דְּעָלְמָא שַׁפִּיר דָּמֵי.
human_translation: not enter your mind as Shmuel said: For example, Pineḥas and I because we are brothers and brothers-in-law, But other brothers-in-law well
llm_translation: Your request is to translate the following Talmudic text into English word-for-word, maintaining the original style and format of Talmudic discourse. Here is the translation: Talmudic text: "לָא סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ, דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: כְּגוֹן אֲנָא וּפִנְחָס דְּהָוֵינַן אֲחֵי וְגִיסֵי, אֲבָל גִּיסֵי דְּעָלְמָא שַׁפִּיר דָּמֵי." English translation: "Not according to your opinion, as Samuel said: For example, Anah and Pinchas who were brothers and relatives, but the relatives of the world are considered valid."

hebrew_text: וְדִילְמָא, כְּגוֹן אֲנָא וּפִנְחָס, מִשּׁוּם גִיסוֹ קָאָמַר?!
human_translation: But perhaps said: For example, Pineḥas and I because his brother-in-law;
llm_translation: And perhaps, like Anah and Pinchas, is he saying it due to his arrogance?!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: זִיל, קַנְיַהּ בְּעֵדֵי מְסִירָה, כְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר.
human_translation: said to go acquire by means of witnesses who observed the transmission in accordance with Rabbi Elazar,
llm_translation: He said to him: Go, acquire it with the witnesses of transfer, like Rabbi Elazar.

hebrew_text: וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא: מוֹדֶה רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בִּמְזוּיָּף מִתּוֹכוֹ שֶׁהוּא פָּסוּל? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: זִיל, לָא שָׁבְקִי לִי דְּאוֹתְבִינֵּיהּ לָךְ.
human_translation: But doesn’t Rabbi Abba say Rabbi Elazar concedes with regard to falsification is inherent in it, that is not valid said to Go do not let me give you
llm_translation: And he said, Rabbi Abba: Does Rabbi Elazar admit to a doubt from within it that it is invalid? He said to him: Go, for I did not leave it for you to understand.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר כּוּ׳. אָמַר רַבִּי תַּנְחוּם אָמַר רַבִּי טַבְלָא אָמַר רַבִּי בְּרוֹנָא אָמַר רַב: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה. רָבָא אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: אֵין הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה. וְכֵן אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אֵין הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says Rabbi Tanḥum says Rabbi Tavla says Rabbi Beruna says Rav says: halakha in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda. Rava Rav Naḥman says: halakha not in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda. And likewise Rabba bar bar Ḥana says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: halakha not in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehudah says: "Thus said Rabbi Tanḥum, said Rabbi Ṭavla, said Rabbi Berona, said Rav: The halakha follows Rabbi Yehudah." Rava said Rav Naḥman: "The halakha does not follow Rabbi Yehudah." And so said Rabbah bar bar Ḥanah said Rabbi Yoḥanan: "The halakha does not follow Rabbi Yehudah."

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּמַתְנֵי לַהּ לְהָא דְּרַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אַהָא: אֶת זוֹ דָּרַשׁ רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי, ״וּבָאתָ אֶל הַכֹּהֲנִים הַלְוִיִּם וְאֶל הַשֹּׁפֵט אֲשֶׁר יִהְיֶה בַּיָּמִים הָהֵם״. וְכִי תַּעֲלֶה עַל דַּעְתְּךָ שֶׁאָדָם הוֹלֵךְ אֵצֶל שׁוֹפֵט שֶׁלֹּא הָיָה בְּיָמָיו? אֶלָּא זֶה שֶׁהָיָה קָרוֹב וְנִתְרַחֵק.
human_translation: There are those who teach of Rabba bar bar Ḥana with regard to this Rabbi Yosei HaGelili interpreted this “And you shall come to the priests the Levites, and to the judge who will be in those days” But will enter your mind that a person go to a judge that was not in his days? Rather, this who was a relative and became not related.
llm_translation: There is one who teaches about this matter of Rabba bar bar Ḥana: "This is what Rabbi Yosei the Galilean expounded, 'And you shall come to the priests, the Levites, and to the judge who will be in those days.'" Do you think it is possible that a person would go to a judge who did not exist in his days? Rather, this refers to one who was close and then moved away.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי.
human_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: halakha in accordance with Rabbi Yosei HaGelili.
llm_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yosei HaGelili.

hebrew_text: בְּנֵי חֲמוּהּ דְּמָר עוּקְבָא
human_translation: The sons of the father-in-law of Mar Ukva
llm_translation: Sons of Hamuah, son of Mar Ukva

hebrew_text: קְרוֹבִים וְנִתְרַחֲקוּ הֲווֹ. אֲתוֹ לְקַמֵּיהּ לְדִינָא. אֲמַר לְהוּ: פְּסִילְנָא לְכוּ לְדִינָא.
human_translation: were relatives and became not related They came before him for judgment. said to them: I am disqualified from adjudicating for you.
llm_translation: Nearby and distanced they were. He came before him for judgment. He said to them: "Bring the idol to judgment."

hebrew_text: אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: מַאי דַּעְתָּיךְ? כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה? אֲנַן מַיְיתִינַן אִיגַּרְתָּא מִמַּעְרְבָא דְּאֵין הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: They said to What is your opinion in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda, We shall bring a letter from the West, that halakha not in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: They said to him: What is your opinion? Like Rabbi Yehuda? We bring a letter from the West that the halacha does not follow Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לְהוּ: אַטּוּ בְּקַבָּא דְקִירָא אִידְּבַקְנָא בְּכוּ? דְּלָא קָאָמֵינָא פְּסִילְנָא לְכוּ לְדִינָא, אֶלָּא מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא צָיְיתִיתוּ דִּינָא.
human_translation: said to them: Is that to say I am stuck to you with a kav of wax [ kira ]? that I am saying that I am disqualified from adjudicating for you only because you will not obey the verdict,
llm_translation: He said to them: Now, in the liver of a fish, do we find a connection with you? For I am not saying to you to nullify the judgment, but because you did not fulfill the judgment.

hebrew_text: אוֹהֵב זֶה שׁוֹשְׁבִינוֹ וְכוּ׳.
human_translation: loves this his groomsman.
llm_translation: Lover this dweller-his and etc.

hebrew_text: וְכַמָּה? אָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה אָמַר רַב: כׇּל שִׁבְעַת יְמֵי הַמִּשְׁתֶּה. וְרַבָּנַן מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרָבָא אָמְרִי: אֲפִילּוּ מִיּוֹם רִאשׁוֹן וְאֵילָךְ.
human_translation: And how long Rabbi Abba says Rabbi Yirmeya says Rav says: all of the seven days of feasting. And the Rabbis say in the name of Rava: Even from the first day and onward
llm_translation: "And how much? Rabbi Abba said, Rabbi Yirmeya said, Rav said: the entire seven days of the feast. And the Rabbis in the name of Rava said: even from the first day and onwards."

hebrew_text: הַשּׂוֹנֵא כֹּל שֶׁלֹּא דִּבֵּר כּוּ׳. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״וְהוּא לֹא אוֹיֵב לוֹ״ – יְעִידֶנּוּ, ״וְלֹא מְבַקֵּשׁ רָעָתוֹ״ – יְדִינֶנּוּ.
human_translation: One who hates anyone did not speak The Sages taught “And he was not his enemy,” can testify about him. “neither sought his harm” can judge him.
llm_translation: The one who hates everything that he did not speak. The Rabbis taught: "And he is not an enemy to him" - let him testify for him, "and does not seek his harm" - let him judge him.

hebrew_text: אַשְׁכְּחַן שׂוֹנֵא, אוֹהֵב מְנָלַן?
human_translation: We found hates; from where do we loves
llm_translation: We find: "One who hates, does he love them?"

hebrew_text: קָרֵי בֵּיהּ הָכִי: וְהוּא לֹא אוֹיֵב לוֹ וְלֹא אוֹהֵב לוֹ – יְעִידֶנּוּ, וְלֹא מְבַקֵּשׁ רָעָתוֹ וְלֹא טוֹבָתוֹ – יְדִינֶנּוּ.
human_translation: read into like this: And he who was not his enemy nor one who loves him, can testify about him; neither sought his harm nor his favor can judge him.
llm_translation: He reads it thus: "And he is not an enemy to him, and not a friend to him - let him testify, and not seek his harm or his good - let him judge him."

hebrew_text: מִידֵּי ״אוֹהֵב״ כְּתִיב? אֶלָּא סְבָרָא הוּא. אוֹיֵב – מַאי טַעְמָא? מִשּׁוּם דִּמְרַחֲקָא דַּעְתֵּיהּ. אוֹהֵב נָמֵי – מְקָרְבָא דַּעְתֵּיהּ.
human_translation: Is: One who loves, written Rather, is logical reasoning: What is the reason an enemy because he feels a sense of aversion loves, as well: He feels a sense of affinity
llm_translation: From where is it written "lover"? Rather, it is a logical deduction. "Enemy" - what is the reason? Because his mind is distant. Also, "lover" - his mind is close.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן, הַאי ״לֹא אוֹיֵב לוֹ וְלֹא מְבַקֵּשׁ רָעָתוֹ״ מַאי דָּרְשִׁי בֵּיהּ?
human_translation: And what do the Rabbis, derive from this “And he was not his enemy, neither sought his harm”?
llm_translation: The sages, this "he is not an enemy to him, and he does not seek his harm," what did he expound in it?

hebrew_text: חַד לְדַיָּין.
human_translation: One for a judge
llm_translation: One for the judges.

hebrew_text: אִידַּךְ, כִּדְתַנְיָא: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, ״וְהוּא לֹא אוֹיֵב לוֹ וְלֹא מְבַקֵּשׁ רָעָתוֹ״ – מִכָּאן לִשְׁנֵי תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים שֶׁשּׂוֹנְאִין זֶה אֶת זֶה, שֶׁאֵין יוֹשְׁבִין בַּדִּין כְּאֶחָד.
human_translation: The other in accordance with that which is taught Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: “And he was not his enemy, neither sought his harm,” from here that two Torah scholars who hate each other cannot sit in judgment as one.
llm_translation: The other opinion as it was taught: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, said, "And he is not an enemy to him, nor does he seek his harm" - from here we learn regarding two scholars who hate each other, that they should not sit in judgment together.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ כֵּיצַד בּוֹדְקִים אֶת הָעֵדִים? הָיוּ מַכְנִיסִין אוֹתָן לַחֶדֶר, וּמְאַיְּימִין עֲלֵיהֶן, וּמוֹצִיאִין אֶת כׇּל הָאָדָם לַחוּץ, וּמְשַׁיְּירִין אֶת הַגָּדוֹל שֶׁבָּהֶן.
human_translation: How do examine the witnesses? They bring them into a room and intimidate them And they take all the people, outside and they leave the eldest of
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: How do they examine the witnesses? They would bring them into a chamber, and intimidate them, and remove all the people outside, and leave the eldest among them.

hebrew_text: וְאוֹמְרִים לוֹ: אֱמוֹר הֵיאַךְ אַתָּה יוֹדֵעַ שֶׁזֶּה חַיָּיב לָזֶה? אִם אָמַר: ״הוּא אָמַר לִי שֶׁאֲנִי חַיָּיב לוֹ״, ״אִישׁ פְּלוֹנִי אָמַר לִי שֶׁהוּא חַיָּיב לוֹ״ – לֹא אָמַר כְּלוּם, עַד שֶׁיֹּאמַר: ״בְּפָנֵינוּ הוֹדָה לוֹ שֶׁהוּא חַיָּיב לוֹ מָאתַיִם זוּז״.
human_translation: And they say to him: Say how you know that this owes money to that If he said: said to me: that I owe So-and-so said to me that owes has said nothing unless he says: admitted in our presence to that he owes him, two hundred dinars.
llm_translation: And they say to him: Say, how do you know that this one is liable to this one? If he said, "He told me that I am liable to him," "So-and-so told me that he is liable to him" - he did not say anything until it is said: "In our presence he admitted that he owes him two hundred zuz."

hebrew_text: וְאַחַר כָּךְ מַכְנִיסִין אֶת הַשֵּׁנִי, וּבוֹדְקִין אוֹתוֹ. אִם נִמְצְאוּ דִּבְרֵיהֶן מְכוּוָּנִין, נוֹשְׂאִין וְנוֹתְנִין בַּדָּבָר.
human_translation: And afterward they bring in the second and examine him If their statements are found to be congruent discuss the matter.
llm_translation: And afterwards they bring in the second one, and examine it. If their words are found to be consistent, they lift it up and engage in the matter.

hebrew_text: שְׁנַיִם אוֹמְרִים: זַכַּאי, וְאֶחָד אוֹמֵר: חַיָּיב – זַכַּאי. שְׁנַיִם אוֹמְרִים: חַיָּיב, וְאֶחָד אוֹמֵר: זַכַּאי – חַיָּיב. אֶחָד אוֹמֵר: חַיָּיב, וְאֶחָד אוֹמֵר: זַכַּאי, אֲפִילּוּ שְׁנַיִם מְזַכִּין אוֹ שְׁנַיִם מְחַיְּיבִין וְאֶחָד אוֹמֵר: אֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ – יוֹסִיפוּ הַדַּיָּינִין.
human_translation: two say exempt and one says liable exempt. two say liable and one says exempt, liable. one says liable and one says exempt, even two deem exempt or two deem liable, and one says: I do not know, must add judges
llm_translation: Two say "innocent," and one says "guilty" - "innocent." Two say "guilty," and one says "innocent" - "guilty." One says "guilty," and one says "innocent," even if two acquit or two convict, and one says, "I do not know" - the judges shall increase.

hebrew_text: גָּמְרוּ אֶת הַדָּבָר, הָיוּ מַכְנִיסִין אוֹתָן. הַגָּדוֹל שֶׁבַּדַּיָּינִין אוֹמֵר: אִישׁ פְּלוֹנִי, אַתָּה זַכַּאי. אִישׁ פְּלוֹנִי, אַתָּה חַיָּיב.
human_translation: finish the matter they bring in The greatest of the judges says: So-and-so, you are exempt So-and-so, you are liable
llm_translation: They concluded the matter, they would bring them in. The greatest among the judges would say: "So-and-so, you are innocent. So-and-so, you are guilty."

hebrew_text: וּמִנַּיִין לִכְשֶׁיֵּצֵא, לֹא יֹאמַר: אֲנִי מְזַכֶּה וַחֲבֵירַיי מְחַיְּיבִים, אֲבָל מָה אֶעֱשֶׂה שֶׁחֲבֵירַיי רַבּוּ עָלַי? עַל זֶה נֶאֱמַר: ״לֹא תֵלֵךְ רָכִיל בְּעַמֶּיךָ״, וְאוֹמֵר: ״הוֹלֵךְ רָכִיל מְגַלֶּה סּוֹד״.
human_translation: And from where when leaves he may not say: I deemed exempt and my colleagues deemed liable, but what can I do, as my colleagues outnumbered me About this it is stated: “You shall not go as a talebearer among your people” and it says: “One who goes about as a talebearer reveals secrets,
llm_translation: From where do we derive that when one leaves, he should not say, "I am exempt while my colleagues are liable," but rather, "What shall I do since my colleagues are superior to me?" Regarding this it is stated: "You shall not go about as a talebearer among your people," and it also says: "He who goes about as a talebearer reveals secrets."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ הֵיכִי אָמְרִינַן לְהוּ? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: הָכִי אָמְרִינַן לְהוּ, ״נְשִׂיאִים וְרוּחַ וְגֶשֶׁם אָיִן אִישׁ מִתְהַלֵּל בְּמַתַּת שָׁקֶר״.
human_translation: What do we say to them? Rav Yehuda says this we say to them: “As clouds and wind without rain, so is he who boasts himself of a false gift”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: How did we say to them? Rav Yehudah said: This is how we said to them, "Princes, and a spirit, and rain—there is no man who boasts in a gift of falsehood."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא, יָכְלִי לְמֵימַר: שַׁב שְׁנֵי הֲוָה כַּפְנָא, וְאַבָּבָא אוּמָּנָא לָא חֲלֵיף.
human_translation: Rava said to him: can say Seven years there was a famine, but over the craftsman’s door it did not pass.
llm_translation: Rava said to him: I am able to say: "Sit, two were like a palm tree, and a father is not a substitute."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא, אָמְרִינַן לְהוּ: ״מֵפִיץ וְחֶרֶב וְחֵץ שָׁנוּן אִישׁ עֹנֶה בְרֵעֵהוּ עֵד שָׁקֶר״.
human_translation: Rather, Rava said we say to them: “As a hammer, and a sword, and a sharp arrow, so is a man who bears false witness against his neighbor”
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said, we say to them: "A maul, a sword, and a sharpened arrow, a man who bears false witness against his neighbor."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אָשֵׁי, יָכְלִי לְמֵימַר: שַׁב שְׁנֵי הֲוָה מוֹתָנָא, וְאִינִישׁ בְּלָא שְׁנֵיהּ לָא שְׁכֵיב.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said to him: can say Seven years there was a pestilence, but a man not his years did not die;
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Ashi, "I could say: 'Sit, two were our deaths,' and a person without his two does not lie down."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: אָמַר לִי נָתָן בַּר מָר זוּטְרָא, אָמְרִינַן לְהוּ: סָהֲדֵי שַׁקָּרֵי אַאוֹגְרַיְיהוּ זִילִי, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְהוֹשִׁיבוּ שְׁנַיִם אֲנָשִׁים בְּנֵי בְלִיַּעַל נֶגְדּוֹ וִיעִדֻהוּ לֵאמֹר בֵּרַכְתָּ אֱלֹהִים וָמֶלֶךְ״.
human_translation: Rather, Rav Ashi said: Natan bar Mar Zutra said to me we say to them false witnesses are belittled by those who hire them, as it is written “And set two men, base fellows, before him, and let them bear witness against him, saying: You cursed God and the king”
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Ashi said: Nathan bar Mar Zutra said to me, we say to them: "False witnesses are to be driven away, as it is written: 'And set two men, sons of Belial, before him, to bear witness against him, saying, Thou didst blaspheme God and the king.'"

hebrew_text: אִם אָמַר ״הוּא אָמַר לִי כּוּ׳״. עַד שֶׁיֹּאמְרוּ: ״בְּפָנֵינוּ הוֹדָה לוֹ שֶׁהוּא חַיָּיב לוֹ מָאתַיִם זוּז״.
human_translation: if said: said to me: unless he says: admitted in our presence to that he owes him two hundred dinars.
llm_translation: "If he said, 'He said to me so and so,' until they say, 'In our presence, he admitted that he owes him two hundred zuz."

hebrew_text: מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ לְרַב יְהוּדָה, דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: צָרִיךְ שֶׁיֹּאמַר ״אַתֶּם עֵדַיי״.
human_translation: This supports Rav Yehuda, as Rav Yehuda says Rav says: needs to say You are my witnesses.
llm_translation: Assisting him to Rav Yehudah, for Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: It is necessary to say, "You are my witnesses."

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר נָמֵי: אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: ״מָנֶה לִי בְּיָדֶךָ״, אָמַר לוֹ: ״הֵן״. לְמָחָר אָמַר לוֹ: ״תְּנֵהוּ לִי״, אָמַר: ״מְשַׁטֶּה אֲנִי בָּךְ״ – פָּטוּר.
human_translation: It was also stated Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: I one hundred dinars in your possession, said to him: Yes, the next day said to him: Give it to me, said I was teasing you, exempt.
llm_translation: It was stated: Rabbi Hiyya bar Abba said in the name of Rabbi Yohanan: "Appoint for me in your hand," he said to him: "Yes." The next day he said to him: "Give it to me," he said: "I am retracting from you" - he is exempt.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: ״מָנֶה לִי בְּיָדֶךָ״, אָמַר לוֹ ״הֵן״. לְמָחָר אָמַר לוֹ ״תְּנֵהוּ לִי״, אָמַר לוֹ ״מְשַׁטֶּה אֲנִי בָּךְ״ – פָּטוּר.
human_translation: This is also taught I one hundred dinars in your possession, said to him: Yes, the next day said to him: Give it to me, said to him: I was teasing you, exempt.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: It was taught in a baraita in the name of the following elder: "Appoint for me in your hand," he said to him, "Yes." The next day he said to him, "Give it to me," he said to him, "I am leaning on you" - he is exempt.

hebrew_text: וְלֹא עוֹד, אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ הִכְמִין לוֹ עֵדִים אֲחוֹרֵי גָּדֵר, וְאָמַר לוֹ: ״מָנֶה לִי בְּיָדֶךָ״, אָמַר לוֹ: ״הֵן״. ״רְצוֹנְךָ שֶׁתּוֹדֶה בִּפְנֵי פְּלוֹנִי וּפְלוֹנִי?״ אָמַר לוֹ: ״מִתְיָירֵא אֲנִי שֶׁמָּא תִּכְפֵּינִי לְדִין״. לְמָחָר אָמַר לוֹ: ״תְּנֵיהוּ לִי״, אָמַר לוֹ: ״מְשַׁטֶּה אֲנִי בָּךְ״ – פָּטוּר.
human_translation: And moreover, even hid witnesses for behind a fence and said to him: I one hundred dinars in your possession, said to him: Yes, Do you wish to admit in the presence of so-and-so and so-and-so? said to him: I am afraid lest you compel me to judgment, the next day said to him: Give me said to him: I was teasing you. exempt
llm_translation: And not only that, but even if he prepared witnesses behind the fence for him, and he said to him: "Appoint for me in your hand," he said to him: "Yes." "Is it your desire to testify in the presence of so-and-so and so-and-so?" He said to him: "I am afraid lest you force me to judgment." The next day he said to him: "Give it to me," he said to him: "I am inclined towards you" - he is exempt.

hebrew_text: וְאֵין טוֹעֲנִין לַמֵּסִית.
human_translation: But do not advance a claim on behalf of an inciter,
llm_translation: And we do not anoint for the temptress.

hebrew_text: מֵסִית? מַאן דְּכַר שְׁמֵיהּ! חַסּוֹרֵי מִיחַסְּרָא וְהָכִי קָתָנֵי: אִם לֹא טָעַן, אֵין טוֹעֲנִין לוֹ. וּבְדִינֵי נְפָשׁוֹת, אַף עַל גַּב דְּלָא טָעַן, טוֹעֲנִין לוֹ. וְאֵין טוֹעֲנִין לַמֵּסִית.
human_translation: An inciter? Who mentioned anything about it? is incomplete, and this is what it is teaching: If did not advance a claim do not advance claim for him. But in capital law, even if did not advance claim advance a claim on his behalf. But do not advance claims on behalf of an inciter.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Meisit? Man dekhar shemeih! Chasorei mikhassera vehakhi katanei: Im lo ta'an, ein to'anin lo. Uv'dinei nefashot, af al gav de'la ta'an, to'anin lo. Ve'ein to'anin la'meisit." English translation: "A tempter? Who is known by name! Those who lack are lacking, and thus it was taught: If he did not load, they do not load for him. And in cases of endangering life, even though he did not load, they load for him. But they do not load for the tempter."

hebrew_text: מַאי שְׁנָא מֵסִית? אָמַר רַבִּי חָמָא בַּר חֲנִינָא: מִפִּירְקֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא שְׁמִיעַ לִי, שָׁאנֵי מֵסִית דְּרַחֲמָנָא אָמַר: ״לֹא תַחְמֹל וְלֹא תְכַסֶּה עָלָיו״.
human_translation: What is different an inciter, Rabbi Ḥama bar Ḥanina says: I heard at the lecture of Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba an inciter is different, as the Merciful One states “Neither shall you spare, neither shall you conceal him”
llm_translation: What is different about a seducer? Rabbi Ḥama son of Ḥanina said: From the words of Rabbi Ḥiyya son of Abba I heard, that a seducer is different, as the Merciful One said: "You shall not spare him, nor conceal him" (Deuteronomy 13:9).

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָן אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן: מִנַּיִין שֶׁאֵין טוֹעֲנִין לַמֵּסִית? מִנָּחָשׁ הַקַּדְמוֹנִי. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי שִׂמְלַאי: הַרְבֵּה טְעָנוֹת הָיָה לוֹ לַנָּחָשׁ לִטְעוֹן, וְלֹא טָעַן. וּמִפְּנֵי מָה לֹא טָעַן לוֹ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא? לְפִי שֶׁלֹּא טָעַן הוּא.
human_translation: Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥman says Rabbi Yonatan says: From where that do not advance a claim on behalf of an inciter? from the primordial snake As Rabbi Simlai says: The snake could have advanced many claims but it did not claim And for what did the Holy One, Blessed be He, not advance claims for it, Because did not advance claims itself.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachman said in the name of Rabbi Yonatan: From where do we derive that the Mesit (enticer to idolatry) is not liable to be stoned? From the ancient serpent. For Rabbi Simlai said: The serpent had many arguments to present, yet it did not present them. Why did the Holy One, blessed be He, not allow it to present its arguments? Because it did not present them.

hebrew_text: מַאי הֲוָה לֵיהּ לְמֵימַר? דִּבְרֵי הָרַב וְדִבְרֵי תַּלְמִיד – דִּבְרֵי מִי שׁוֹמְעִין? דִּבְרֵי הָרַב שׁוֹמְעִין.
human_translation: What could he have said? the statement of the teacher and the statement of the student, whose statement should one listen to? One should listen to the statement of the teacher.
llm_translation: What was it that he intended to say? The words of the master and the words of the disciple - whose words are they? The words of the master are heard.

hebrew_text: אָמַר חִזְקִיָּה: מִנַּיִין שֶׁכׇּל הַמּוֹסִיף גּוֹרֵעַ? שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אָמַר אֱלֹהִים לֹא תֹאכְלוּ מִמֶּנּוּ וְלֹא תִגְּעוּ בּוֹ״.
human_translation: Ḥizkiyya says: From where that anyone who adds, subtracts? as it is stated “God has said: You shall not eat of it, neither shall you touch it”
llm_translation: Hizkiyah said: From where do we derive that anyone who adds, diminishes? As it is stated: "God said, 'You shall not eat from it, nor shall you touch it.'"

hebrew_text: רַב מְשַׁרְשְׁיָא אָמַר, מֵהָכָא: ״אַמָּתַיִם וָחֵצִי אׇרְכּוֹ״.
human_translation: Rav Mesharshiyya says from here: “Two cubits [ amatayim ] and a half shall be its length”
llm_translation: Rav Mesharshaya said, from here: "two and a half cubits its length."

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: ״עַשְׁתֵּי עֶשְׂרֵה יְרִיעֹת״.
human_translation: Rav Ashi says “Eleven [ ashtei esrei ] curtains”
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: "Twelve curtains."

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא דְּאָמַר ״מְשַׁטֶּה אֲנִי בָּךְ״, אֲבָל אָמַר
human_translation: Abaye says: taught only where he says: I was teasing you. But he says:
llm_translation: Abaye said: They only taught this law in a case where he said, "I am disgusted by you," but if he said

hebrew_text: ״לֹא הָיוּ דְבָרִים מֵעוֹלָם״ – הוּחְזַק כַּפְרָן.
human_translation: These matters never occurred, assumes the presumptive status of one who denies
llm_translation: "Not were words from ever" - was established like Capernaum.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אַחָא בַּר אַדָּא, הָכִי אָמְרִינַן מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרָבָא: כֹּל מִילֵּי דִּכְדִי לָא דְּכִירִי אִינָשֵׁי.
human_translation: Rav Pappa, son of Rav Aḥa bar Adda, says: This we say in the name of Rava: people do not remember all frivolous matters.
llm_translation: Rav Papa, son of Rav Acha bar Adda, said thus in the name of Rava: "All matters that are not recognizable to people."

hebrew_text: הָהוּא דְּאַכְמֵין לֵיהּ עֵדִים לְחַבְרֵיהּ בְּכִילְּתֵיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: ״מָנֶה לִי בִּידָךְ״. אָמַר לֵיהּ: ״הֵן״. אָמַר: ״עֵירֵי וְשָׁכְבֵי לֶיהֱווֹ עֲלָךְ סָהֲדֵי״. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: ״לָא״. אֲמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא: הָא אֲמַר לֵיהּ ״לָא״.
human_translation: a certain who hid witnesses in canopy his to another. said to him: I one hundred dinars in your possession. said to him: Yes. said: Let those awake and those asleep bear witness about you, said to him: No. Rav Kahana said: he said no to him,
llm_translation: That one who was arranging witnesses for his friends with his cunning. He said to him: "Appoint for me in your hand." He said to him: "Yes." He said: "Cities and their surrounding fields will be witnesses against you." He said to him: "No." Rav Kahana said: That one said to him "No."

hebrew_text: הָהוּא דְּאַכְמֵין עֵדִים בְּקִיבְרָא לְחַבְרֵיהּ, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: ״מָנֶה לִי בִּידָךְ״. אָמַר לֵיהּ: ״הֵן״. חַיֵּי וּמִיתֵי לֶיהֱווֹ עֲלָךְ סָהֲדִי, אָמַר לֵיהּ: ״לָא״. אֲמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן [בֶּן לָקִישׁ]: הָא אֲמַר לֵיהּ ״לָא״.
human_translation: a certain who hid witnesses in a grave to another. said to him: I one hundred dinars in your possession. said to him: Yes. said: Let the living and the dead bear witness about you. said to him: No. Rabbi Shimon said: he said no to him,
llm_translation: That one who establishes witnesses in the cemetery for his friends, he said to him: "Appoint for me in your hand." He said to him: "Yes." "May both life and death be upon you as witnesses," he said to him: "No." Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: If he said to him "No."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבִינָא, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַב פָּפָּא: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ מֵהָא, הָא דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: צָרִיךְ שֶׁיֹּאמַר ״אַתֶּם עֵדַיי״, לָא שְׁנָא כִּי אָמַר לֹוֶה, וְלָא שְׁנָא כִּי אָמַר מַלְוֶה וְשָׁתֵיק לֹוֶה. טַעְמָא דְּאָמַר לֹוֶה ״לָא״, אֲבָל אִי שָׁתֵיק – הָכִי נָמֵי.
human_translation: Ravina said, and some say Rav Pappa Conclude from it that which Rav Yehuda says Rav says, needs to say You are my witnesses, is no difference whether the debtor said and is no difference whether the creditor said and the debtor remained silent. the reason is that the debtor said no, but had he remained silent indeed
llm_translation: Ravina said, and some say Rav Papa: Learn from this, that which Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: It is necessary to say "You are my witnesses," it does not matter if the lender said, and it does not matter if the borrower said and the lender remained silent. The reason the lender said "no," but if he remained silent - this is indeed so.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא דַּהֲוָה קָרוּ לֵיהּ ״קַב רָשׁוּ״, אֲמַר: מַאן מַסֵּיק בִּי אֶלָּא פְּלוֹנִי וּפְלוֹנִי? אֲתוֹ, תַּבְעוּהּו לְדִינָא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן.
human_translation: a certain whom called: A kav of debts, said: Who can claim from me, other than so-and-so and so-and-so? came took him to judgment before Rav Naḥman
llm_translation: That one who was called "Kav Rashu," said: Who is testifying against me, except so-and-so and so-and-so? They brought him to the court of Rav Nachman.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: אָדָם עָשׂוּי שֶׁלֹּא לְהַשְׂבִּיעַ אֶת עַצְמוֹ.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said: A person is prone so as not to make himself sated,
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said: A person is made not to satiate himself.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא דַּהֲווֹ קָרוּ לֵיהּ ״עַכְבְּרָא דְּשָׁכֵיב אַדִּינָרֵי״. כִּי קָא שָׁכֵיב, אֲמַר: ״פְּלָנְיָא וּפְלָנְיָא מַסְּקוּ בִּי זוּזֵי״. בָּתַר דִּשְׁכֵיב, אֲתוֹ תַּבְעִינְהוּ לְיוֹרְשִׁין.
human_translation: a certain whom called: A mouse that lies on dinars, said on his deathbed: So-and-so and so-and-so claim dinars from me. After he died, came sued the heirs.
llm_translation: That one who was called "the mouse who slept with dinars." When he was lying down, he said, "So-and-so and so-and-so owe me money." After he lay down, his heirs came to collect from them.

hebrew_text: אֲתוֹ לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי. אֲמַר לְהוּ: כִּי אָמְרִינַן ״אָדָם עָשׂוּי שֶׁלֹּא לְהַשְׂבִּיעַ אֶת עַצְמוֹ״, הָנֵי מִילֵּי מֵחַיִּים, אֲבָל לְאַחַר מִיתָה – לָא.
human_translation: They came before Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei. He said to them: When we say a person is prone so as not to make himself sated, this statement during his lifetime. But after death, not
llm_translation: They came before Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yose. He said to them: As we say, "A person is made not to satisfy himself," those are words of the living, but after death - no.

hebrew_text: פְּרַעוּ פַּלְגָא, תַּבְעִינְהוּ לְדִינָא לְאִידַּךְ פַּלְגָא. אֲתוֹ לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי חִיָּיא. אֲמַר לְהוּ: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁאָדָם עָשׂוּי שֶׁלֹּא לְהַשְׂבִּיעַ אֶת עַצְמוֹ, כָּךְ אָדָם עָשׂוּי שֶׁלֹּא לְהַשְׂבִּיעַ אֶת בָּנָיו. אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: נֵיזִיל וְנַיהְדַּר? אֲמַר לְהוּ: כְּבָר הוֹרָה זָקֵן.
human_translation: paid half sued them for the other half. They came before Rabbi Ḥiyya. said to them: Just as a person is prone so as not to make himself sated, so too, a person is prone so as not to make his sons sated. said to him: let us go and overturn said to them: The elder, has already issued a ruling
llm_translation: They divided the estate; let them go to court for this half. They came before Rabbi Chiya. He said to them: Just as a person is destined not to satisfy himself, so too a person is destined not to satisfy his children. They said to him: Shall we go and be disgraced? He said to them: An elder has already ruled.

hebrew_text: הוֹדָה בִּפְנֵי שְׁנַיִם, וְקָנוּ מִיָּדוֹ – כּוֹתְבִין, וְאִם לָאו – אֵין כּוֹתְבִין.
human_translation: made an admission in the presence of two and they performed act of acquisition with him can write But if not they may not write
llm_translation: Acknowledgment in the presence of two, and they acquired from him - they write, and if not - they do not write.

hebrew_text: בִּפְנֵי שְׁלֹשָׁה, וְלֹא קָנוּ מִיָּדוֹ. רַב אַמֵּי אָמַר: כּוֹתְבִין, וְרַב אַסִּי אָמַר: אֵין כּוֹתְבִין. הֲוָה עוֹבָדָא, וְחַשׁ לַהּ רַב לְהָא דְּרַב אַסִּי.
human_translation: in the presence of three and they did not perform act of acquisition with him, Rav Ami says: They can write And Rav Asi says: They may not write There was an incident and Rav was concerned for this of Rav Asi,
llm_translation: Before three, and did not acquire from him. Rav Ammi said: They write, and Rav Assi said: They do not write. There was an incident, and Rav was concerned for the opinion of Rav Assi.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה: הָא אוֹדִיתָא, זִימְנִין כָּתְבִינַן וְזִימְנִין לָא כָּתְבִינַן. כְּנִיפִי וְיָתְבִי – לָא כָּתְבִינַן, כַּנְפִינְהוּ אִיהוּ – כָּתְבִינַן.
human_translation: Rav Adda bar Ahava says: this admission, sometimes we write and sometimes we do not write gathered and sitting we do not write gathered them, we write
llm_translation: Rav Adda bar Ahava said: Here in this case, sometimes we write and sometimes we do not write. When it is "kinfi" and "yatvi" - we do not write, but when it is "kanfihoo" - we write.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ כַּנְפִינְהוּ אִיהוּ – לָא כָּתְבִינַן, עַד דְּאָמַר לְהוּ: ״הֱווֹ עֲלַי דַּיָּינֵי״.
human_translation: Rava says: Even he gathered them we do not write unless he says to them: Be my judges.
llm_translation: Rava said: Even if they are his own wings - we do not write them, until he says to them: "Be my guarantors."

hebrew_text: מָר בַּר רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ אָמַר ״הֱווֹ עֲלַי דַּיָּינֵי״, לָא כָּתְבִינַן עַד דְּקָבְעִי דּוּכְתָּא, וְשָׁלְחִי, וּמַזְמְנִי לֵיהּ לְבֵי דִינָא.
human_translation: Mar bar Rav Ashi says: Even he says: Be my judges, we do not write unless they establish a place and send and summon him to court.
llm_translation: Mar bar Rav Ashi said: Even if he said, "Be my witnesses," we do not write the document until he establishes a fixed place, sends the witnesses, and appoints a time for them to come to the court.

hebrew_text: הוֹדָה בְּמִטַּלְטְלֵי, וְקָנוּ מִיָּדוֹ – כּוֹתְבִין, וְאִם לָאו – אֵין כּוֹתְבִין. בִּמְקַרְקְעֵי, וְלֹא קָנוּ מִיָּדוֹ, מַאי? אַמֵּימָר אָמַר: אֵין כּוֹתְבִין. מָר זוּטְרָא אָמַר: כּוֹתְבִין. וְהִלְכְתָא: כּוֹתְבִין.
human_translation: he made an admission with regard to movable property and performed act of acquisition with him, they can write but if not they may not write with regard to land, and they did not perform act of acquisition with him, what Ameimar says: They may not write Mar Zutra says: They may write And the halakha they may write
llm_translation: Acknowledgment with movable objects, and he acquired from his hand - they write, and if not - they do not write. In the ground, and he did not acquire from his hand, what is the law? Ameimar said: They do not write. Mar Zutra said: They write. And the halakha is: They write.

hebrew_text: רָבִינָא אִיקְּלַע לְדִמְהַרְיָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב דִּימִי בַּר רַב הוּנָא מִדִּמְהַרְיָא לְרָבִינָא: מִטַּלְטְלִי וְאִיתַנְהוּ בְּעֵינַיְיהוּ, מַאי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: כִּמְקַרְקְעֵי דָּמוּ. רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: כֵּיוָן דִּמְחַסְּרִי גּוּבְיָינָא, לָא.
human_translation: Ravina happened to Damharya. Rav Dimi bar Rav Huna of Damharya said to Ravina: movable property that is extant, what said to him: It is like land. Rav Ashi says: Since it lacks collection, may not
llm_translation: Ravina encountered the residents of Dimeharya. Rav Dimi son of Rav Huna said to Ravina: "Let us shake them and see what they are made of." What did he mean? He said to him: "Like the earthenware jugs." Rav Ashi said: "Once the holes are plugged, no."

hebrew_text: הָהִיא אוֹדִיתָא דְּלָא הֲוָה כְּתִב בַּהּ ״אֲמַר לַנָא, כְּתֻבוּ וַחֲתֻמוּ וְהַבוּ לֵיהּ״, אַבָּיֵי וְרָבָא דְּאָמְרִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ: הַיְינוּ דְּרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ.
human_translation: a certain admission in which was not written: He, said to us: Write and sign and give to Abaye and Rava both say this is of Reish Lakish
llm_translation: That case of where it was not written in it, "He said to us, 'Write and sign and give it to him,'" Abbaye and Rava both said: That is what Reish Lakish expounded.

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: חֲזָקָה אֵין הָעֵדִים חוֹתְמִין עַל הַשְּׁטָר, אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן נַעֲשָׂה גָּדוֹל.
human_translation: As Reish Lakish says: a presumption witnesses do not sign on the document unless was transacted with an adult,
llm_translation: The head of the academy, Reish Lakish, said: Strong, the witnesses do not sign on the document, unless it is made great.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב פַּפֵּי, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: מִי אִיכָּא מִידֵּי דַּאֲנַן לָא יָדְעִינַן, וְסָפְרֵי דְּבֵי דִינָא יָדְעִי?
human_translation: Rav Pappi objects to this, and some say Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, Is there anything that we, do not know, and the scribes of the court know?
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: Rav Pappa objects to her, and it was stated: Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said: Is there anyone here who knows what we do not know, but the scribes of the court know?

hebrew_text: שְׁאֵילִינְהוּ לְסָפְרֵי דְאַבָּיֵי, וְיָדְעִי. לְסָפְרֵי דְרָבָא, וְיָדְעִי.
human_translation: Abaye’s scribes were asked and they were aware Rava’s scribes and they were aware
llm_translation: Ask them to the books of Abbaye, and you will know. To the books of Rava, and you will know.

hebrew_text: הָהִיא אוֹדִיתָא דַּהֲוָה כְּתִב בַּיהּ ״דּוּכְרַן פִּיתְגָמֵי״,
human_translation: a certain admission in which was written a record of the proceedings
llm_translation: That rod that was inscribed on it "Duchran Pithgmei,"

hebrew_text: וְכֹל לִישָּׁנֵי דְּבֵי דִינָא, וְלָא הֲוָה כְּתִב בַּהּ ״בְּמוֹתַב תְּלָתָא הֲוֵינָא וְחַד לֵיתוֹהִי״.
human_translation: and all of the formulations of the court and was not written in it: We were in a session of three and one is no
llm_translation: "And all the judges of the court, and there was not written in it, 'In the sitting of three I was and one was not there.'"

hebrew_text: סְבַר רָבִינָא לְמֵימַר: הַיְינוּ דְּרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב נָתָן בַּר אַמֵּי: הָכִי אָמְרִינַן מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרָבָא, כֹּל כִּי הַאי גַוְונָא חָיְישִׁינַן לְבֵית דִּין טוֹעִין.
human_translation: Ravina thought to say this is of Reish Lakish, Rav Natan bar Ami said to him: This we say in the name of Rava: any cases like this, we are concerned for an erroneous court
llm_translation: Ravina thought to say: This is what Reish Lakish meant. Rav Natan bar Ammi said to him: This is what we say in the name of Rava, whenever we are concerned about this type of case, we bring it before the court for deliberation.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: אִי כְּתִב בַּהּ ״בֵּי דִינָא״, תּוּ לָא צְרִיךְ.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak says: If it was written in the court, unnecessary further
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: If it was written in it "Beit Din," it is not necessary.

hebrew_text: וְדִילְמָא בֵּית דִּין חָצוּף הוּא? דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: שְׁנַיִם שֶׁדָּנוּ, דִּינֵיהֶן דִּין, אֶלָּא שֶׁנִּקְרְאוּ בֵּית דִּין חָצוּף. דִּכְתִב בַּיהּ: ״בֵּי דִינָא דְּרַבְנָא אָשֵׁי״.
human_translation: But perhaps it was an impudent court, as Shmuel says: two who judged, their verdict is verdict; but they are called an impudent court. in which it was written: the court of Rabbana Ashi,
llm_translation: Perhaps the court is presumptuous? For Shmuel said: Two who judged, their judgment is a judgment, but they were called a presumptuous court. As it is written in it: "In the court of Ravna Ashi."

hebrew_text: וְדִילְמָא רַבָּנַן דְּבֵי רַב אָשֵׁי כִּשְׁמוּאֵל סְבִירָא לְהוּ? דִּכְתִיב בַּהּ: ״וַאֲמַרְנָא לֵיהּ לְרַבַּנָא אָשֵׁי״, ״וַאֲמַר לַן רַבַּנָא אָשֵׁי.״
human_translation: But perhaps the Sages of the court of Rav Ashi hold like Shmuel, in which it is written: And we said to Rabbana Ashi, and Rabbana Ashi said to us.
llm_translation: Perhaps the sages of the house of Rav Ashi hold like Shmuel? For it is written in it: "And we said to him, to Rabbanah Ashi," "And Rabbanah Ashi said to us."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן, אָמַר לָהֶן אֶחָד: אֲנִי רָאִיתִי אֲבִיכֶם שֶׁהִטְמִין מָעוֹת בְּשִׁידָּה, תֵּיבָה, וּמִגְדָּל, וְאָמַר ״שֶׁל פְּלוֹנִי הֵן״, ״שֶׁל מַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי הֵן״ – בַּבַּיִת לֹא אָמַר כְּלוּם, בַּשָּׂדֶה דְּבָרָיו קַיָּימִין.
human_translation: The Sages taught one said to I saw that your father hid money in a chest, box, or cabinet, saying: belongs to so-and-so, is second tithe, in the house, said nothing. in the field, his statement stands,
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: One of them said to them: I saw your father hiding coins in a chest, a box, and a tower, and he said, "These belong to so-and-so, these belong to second tithe." In the house, he said nothing; in the field, his words are upheld.

hebrew_text: כְּלָלוֹ שֶׁל דָּבָר: כֹּל שֶׁבְּיָדוֹ לִיטְּלָן – דְּבָרָיו קַיָּימִין; אֵין בְּיָדוֹ לִיטְּלָן – לֹא אָמַר כְּלוּם.
human_translation: The principle of the matter any where it is in power of to take his statement stands; it is not in his power to take he has said nothing.
llm_translation: The principle of a matter: Anything that is in his hand to take off - his words are established; if it is not in his hand to take off - he did not say anything.

hebrew_text: הֲרֵי שֶׁרָאוּ אֶת אֲבִיהֶן שֶׁהִטְמִין מָעוֹת בְּשִׁידָּה תֵּיבָה וּמִגְדָּל, וְאָמַר: ״שֶׁל פְּלוֹנִי הֵן״, ״שֶׁל מַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי הֵן״ – אִם כְּמוֹסֵר, דְּבָרָיו קַיָּימִין; אִם כְּמַעֲרִים, לֹא אָמַר כְּלוּם.
human_translation: where saw that their father hid money in a chest, box, or cabinet, and said: belongs to so-and-so, is second tithe, if as one who relays his statement stands. if as one who employs artifice, he has said nothing,
llm_translation: Behold, if they saw their father who hid coins in a chest, a box, and a tower, and he said: "These belong to so-and-so," "These are for the second tithe" - if consistent, his words are upheld; if inconsistent, he said nothing.

hebrew_text: הֲרֵי שֶׁהָיָה מִצְטַעֵר עַל מָעוֹת שֶׁהִנִּיחַ לוֹ אָבִיו, וּבָא בַּעַל הַחֲלוֹם וְאָמַר לוֹ: ״כָּךְ וְכָךְ הֵן״, ״בְּמָקוֹם פְּלוֹנִי הֵן״, ״שֶׁל מַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי הֵן״. זֶה הָיָה מַעֲשֶׂה, וְאָמְרוּ: דִּבְרֵי חֲלוֹמוֹת לֹא מַעֲלִין וְלֹא מוֹרִידִין.
human_translation: where was distressed about money that his father left him and the master of the dream, came and said to him: It is such and such it is in such and such a place, is second tithe, this was incident and they said matters dreams do not make a difference
llm_translation: Behold, if he was distressed over the coins that his father left for him, and the dream interpreter came and said to him: "Thus and thus they are," "they are in a certain place," "they are of second tithe." This was the incident, and they said: The words of dreams neither ascend nor descend.

hebrew_text: שְׁנַיִם אוֹמְרִים זַכַּאי כּוּ׳. מִיכְתָּב הֵיכִי כָּתְבִי?
human_translation: two say exempt how do they write
llm_translation: Two say "Zakkai is correct." From where did they write this?

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: ״זַכַּאי״. רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר: ״פְּלוֹנִי וּפְלוֹנִי מְזַכִּין, וּפְלוֹנִי וּפְלוֹנִי מְחַיְּיבִין״. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אָמַר: ״מִדִּבְרֵיהֶן נִזְדַּכָּה פְּלוֹנִי״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: exempt, Reish Lakish says So-and-so and so-and-so deem exempt, and so-and-so and so-and-so deem liable; Rabbi Eliezer says From the statement of so-and-so was deemed exempt,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: "Zakkai." Reish Lakish said: "So-and-so and so-and-so acquit, and so-and-so and so-and-so obligate." Rabbi Eliezer said: "From their words, so-and-so was acquitted."

hebrew_text: מַאי בֵּינַיְיהוּ? אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ לְשַׁלּוֹמֵי אִיהוּ מְנָתָא בַּהֲדַיְיהוּ, דִּלְמַאן דְּאָמַר ״זַכַּאי״ – מְשַׁלֵּם, וּלְמַאן דְּאָמַר ״פְּלוֹנִי וּפְלוֹנִי מְזַכִּין וּפְלוֹנִי וּפְלוֹנִי מְחַיְּיבִין״ – לָא מְשַׁלֵּם.
human_translation: What between between them with regard to pay portion along with As according to the one who says exempt, pays and according to the one who says So-and-so and so-and-so deem exempt, and so-and-so and so-and-so deem liable, he does not pay.
llm_translation: What is the difference between them? There is a difference between them regarding the payment. For according to the one who says "he is deserving," he pays, and according to the one who says "so-and-so and so-and-so are exempting and so-and-so and so-and-so are obligating," he does not pay.

hebrew_text: וּלְמַאן דְּאָמַר ״זַכַּאי״, מְשַׁלֵּם?! לֵימָא לְהוּ: אִי לְדִידִי צָיְיתִיתוּן, אַתּוּן נָמֵי לָא מְשַׁלְּמִיתוּן!
human_translation: But according to the one who says exempt, does he pay? Let him say to If you would have listened to me you would not have paid either.
llm_translation: And for the one who says "he is deserving," he pays?! Let us say to them: If you have acted for my benefit, you have not acted for your benefit!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ לְשַׁלּוֹמֵי אִינְהוּ מְנָתָא דִּידֵיהּ: לְמַאן דְּאָמַר ״זַכַּאי״ – מְשַׁלְּמִי, לְמַאן דְּאָמַר ״פְּלוֹנִי וּפְלוֹנִי מְזַכִּין וּפְלוֹנִי וּפְלוֹנִי מְחַיְּיבִין״ – לָא מְשַׁלְּמִי.
human_translation: Rather, between with regard to those pay his portion According to the one who says exempt, they pay according to the one who says So-and-so and so-and-so deem exempt, and so-and-so and so-and-so deem liable, they do not pay
llm_translation: Rather, there is a distinction between them regarding the ownership of the garment: according to the one who says "he is deserving" - he pays, according to the one who says "so-and-so and so-and-so are exempt, and so-and-so and so-and-so are liable" - he does not pay.

hebrew_text: וּלְמַאן דְּאָמַר זַכַּאי, מְשַׁלְּמִי? וְלֵימְרוּ לֵיהּ: אִי לָאו אַתְּ בַּהֲדַן, לָא הֲוָה סָלֵיק דִּינָא מִידֵּי!
human_translation: But according to the one who says exempt, do they pay Let them say to him: If you had not been with us the judgment would have had no verdict at all,
llm_translation: And for the one who says "he is deserving," who pays? And let them say to him: If you are not in Hadan, the judgment would not have been removed from you!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ מִשּׁוּם ״לֹא תֵלֵךְ רָכִיל בְּעַמֶּיךָ״. רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: ״זַכַּאי״ – מִשּׁוּם ״לֹא תֵלֵךְ רָכִיל״.
human_translation: Rather, between due to “You shall not go as a talebearer among your people” Rabbi Yoḥanan says exempt due to “You shall not go as a talebearer.”
llm_translation: Rather, there is a distinction between them regarding "You shall not go about as a talebearer among your people." Rabbi Yochanan said: "Zakkai" - because of "You shall not go about as a talebearer."

hebrew_text: רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר: ״פְּלוֹנִי וּפְלוֹנִי מְזַכִּין, וּפְלוֹנִי וּפְלוֹנִי מְחַיְּיבִין״ – מִשּׁוּם דְּמִיחֲזֵי כְּשִׁיקְרָא.
human_translation: Reish Lakish says So-and-so and so-and-so deem exempt, and so-and-so and so-and-so deem liable, because have the appearance of falsehood,
llm_translation: Reish Lakish said: "So-and-so and so-and-so acquit, and so-and-so and so-and-so obligate" - because they appear like false witnesses.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אִית לֵיהּ דְּמָר, וְאִית לֵיהּ דְּמָר. הִלְכָּךְ, כָּתְבִי הָכִי: ״מִדִּבְרֵיהֶם נִזְדַּכָּה פְּלוֹנִי״.
human_translation: And Rabbi Elazar accepts of Sage, and accepts of Sage, Therefore, this they write: From the statement of so-and-so was deemed exempt.
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar has a teacher, and he has a teacher. Therefore, it is written thus: "From their words, Ploni was established."

hebrew_text: גָּמְרוּ אֶת הַדָּבָר, הָיוּ מַכְנִיסִין כּוּ׳. לְמַאן? אִילֵימָא לְבַעֲלֵי דִינִין – הָתָם קָיְימִי! אֶלָּא לְעֵדִים.
human_translation: finished the matter they would bring in. Whom If we say the litigants, they were there Rather, the witnesses.
llm_translation: They concluded the matter, they would bring in the following point. According to whom? If you say according to the judges - there it is established! Rather, it refers to the witnesses.

hebrew_text: כְּמַאן? דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי נָתָן, דְּתַנְיָא: לְעוֹלָם אֵין עֵדוּתָן מִצְטָרֶפֶת עַד שֶׁיִּרְאוּ שְׁנֵיהֶן כְּאֶחָד. רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן קָרְחָה אוֹמֵר: אֲפִילּוּ בָּזֶה אַחַר זֶה.
human_translation: in accordance with whose not in accordance with Rabbi Natan; as it is taught The testimonies of are never combined unless the two of them saw as one. Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korḥa says: even in one after the other.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Like whom? That not like Rabbi Natan, as it was taught: Their testimony is never combined until they both see together. Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korcha says: Even if one after the other.

hebrew_text: וְאֵין עֵדוּתָן מִתְקַיֶּימֶת בְּבֵית דִּין עַד שֶׁיָּעִידוּ שְׁנֵיהֶן כְּאֶחָד. רַבִּי נָתָן אוֹמֵר: שׁוֹמְעִין דְּבָרָיו שֶׁל זֶה הַיּוֹם, וּכְשֶׁיָּבֹא חֲבֵירוֹ לְמָחָר שׁוֹמְעִין אֶת דְּבָרָיו.
human_translation: And their testimony does not stand in court unless the two of them testify as one. Rabbi Natan says: hear the statement of this today, and when the other comes tomorrow hear his statement.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "And their testimony is not established in the court until both of them testify together. Rabbi Natan says: We hear the words of this one today, and when his fellow comes tomorrow, we hear his words."

hebrew_text: לָא, לְעוֹלָם לְבַעֲלֵי דִינִין. וְרַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה הִיא, דְּתַנְיָא: רַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה אוֹמֵר, כָּךְ הָיָה מִנְהָגָן שֶׁל נְקִיֵּי הַדַּעַת שֶׁבִּירוּשָׁלַיִם: מַכְנִיסִין לְבַעֲלֵי דִינִין וְשׁוֹמְעִין דִּבְרֵיהֶן, וּמַכְנִיסִין אֶת הָעֵדִים וְשׁוֹמְעִין דִּבְרֵיהֶם, וּמוֹצִיאִין אוֹתָן לַחוּץ וְנוֹשְׂאִין וְנוֹתְנִין בְּדָבָר. גָּמְרוּ אֶת הַדָּבָר, מַכְנִיסִין אוֹתָן כּוּ׳.
human_translation: No, actually the litigants; and it is Rabbi Neḥemya. As it is taught Rabbi Neḥemya says: This was the custom of the scrupulous people of Jerusalem: they bring in the litigants and hear their statements, and they bring in the witnesses and hear their statements and they take them outside and discuss the matter they finished the matter they bring them, in,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: No, always to the judges. And Rabbi Neḥemyah, as it was taught: Rabbi Neḥemyah says, this was the custom of the men of understanding in Jerusalem: they would bring in the judges and hear their words, and bring in the witnesses and hear their words, and then they would take them outside and confer and deliberate. Once they concluded the matter, they would bring them back in.

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא: גָּמְרוּ אֶת הַדָּבָר, מַכְנִיסִין אֶת הָעֵדִים! הָהִיא דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי נָתָן.
human_translation: But isn’t it taught they finished the matter they bring in the witnesses? That not in accordance with Rabbi Natan.
llm_translation: And it was taught in a Baraita: Once they have concluded the matter, the witnesses are brought in! That ruling is not in accordance with Rabbi Natan.

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא: לְעוֹלָם אֵין עֵדוּתָן מִצְטָרֶפֶת עַד שֶׁיִּרְאוּ שְׁנֵיהֶם כְּאֶחָד. רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן קָרְחָה אוֹמֵר: אֲפִילּוּ בָּזֶה אַחַר זֶה. בְּמַאי קָמִיפַּלְגִי? אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא קְרָא, וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא סְבָרָא.
human_translation: the itself: The testimonies of are never combined unless the two of them saw as one. Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korḥa says: even in one after the other. With regard to what do they disagree? If you wish, say a verse, and if you wish, say logical reasoning.
llm_translation: Body: Always their testimony is not combined until they both see as one. Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korcha says: Even if one after the other. With what do they disagree? If you wish, say Scripture, and if you wish, say reasoning.

hebrew_text: אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא סְבָרָא: אַמָּנֶה דְּקָא מַסְהֵיד הַאי, לָא קָא מַסְהֵיד הַאי, וּמָנֶה דְּקָא מַסְהֵיד הַאי, לָא קָמַסְהֵיד הַאי. וְאִידַּךְ: אַמָּנֶה בְּעָלְמָא תַּרְוַיְיהוּ קָמַסְהֲדִי.
human_translation: If you wish, say logical reasoning: about the one hundred dinars that this is testifying, that is not testifying, and the one hundred dinars that that is testifying, this one is not testifying. And the other both are testifying about one hundred dinars in general,
llm_translation: If you want, say: A craftsman who is illuminating this, is not illuminating that, and a craftsman who is illuminating that, is not illuminating this. And the other opinion: A craftsman in the world, both are illuminated.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא קְרָא, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְהוּא עֵד אוֹ רָאָה אוֹ יָדָע״.
human_translation: And if you wish, say a verse, as it is written: and he is a witness, whether he has seen or known,
llm_translation: And if you wish, say the verse, as it is written: "And he is a witness, whether he has seen or known."

hebrew_text: וְתַנְיָא: מִמַּשְׁמַע שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לֹא יָקוּם עֵד״ – אֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ שֶׁהוּא אֶחָד? מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״אֶחָד״?
human_translation: And it is taught by inference, from that is stated A witness shall not rise up do I not know that it is one what the verse states “One
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it was taught in a Baraita: From where do we derive this, as it is stated: "A single witness shall not rise up" - do I not know that it is one? What is the teaching to say "one"?

hebrew_text: זֶה בָּנָה אָב: כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״עֵד״ – הֲרֵי כָּאן שְׁנַיִם, עַד שֶׁיִּפְרֹט לְךָ הַכָּתוּב ״אֶחָד״.
human_translation: This established a paradigm, every place where “witness” is stated, there are two unless the verse specifies for you one
llm_translation: This is the statement of Rabbi Abba: Any place where it says "witness" - here there are two, until the verse specifies to you "one."

hebrew_text: וְאַפְּקֵיהּ רַחֲמָנָא בִּלְשׁוֹן חַד, לְמֵימַר: עַד דְּחָזוּ תַּרְוַויְיהוּ כְּחַד. וְאִידַּךְ, ״וְהוּא עֵד אוֹ רָאָה אוֹ יָדָע״ – מִכׇּל מָקוֹם.
human_translation: And the Merciful One expresses it in the singular form, to say unless the two of them saw as one. And the other “And he is a witness, whether he has seen or known,” in any case
llm_translation: The Merciful One anticipated it in one language, to say: Until they both see it as one. And the other, "whether he is a witness or saw or knew" - in any case.

hebrew_text: וְאֵין עֵדוּתָן מִתְקַיֶּימֶת בְּבֵית דִּין עַד שֶׁיָּעִידוּ שְׁנֵיהֶן כְּאֶחָד. רַבִּי נָתָן אוֹמֵר: שׁוֹמְעִין דְּבָרָיו שֶׁל זֶה הַיּוֹם, וּכְשֶׁיָּבֹא חֲבֵירוֹ לְמָחָר שׁוֹמְעִין דְּבָרָיו. בְּמַאי קָמִיפַּלְגִי? אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא סְבָרָא, אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא קְרָא.
human_translation: And their testimony does not stand in court unless the two of them testify as one. Rabbi Natan says: hear the statement of this today, and when the other comes tomorrow hear his statement. With regard to what do they disagree? If you wish, say logical reasoning, if you wish, say a verse.
llm_translation: "And their testimony is not upheld in the court until both of them testify together as one. Rabbi Natan says: We listen to the words of this one today, and when his fellow comes tomorrow, we listen to his words. What is the point of their disagreement? If you wish, say it is a matter of logic; if you wish, say it is a matter of scripture."

hebrew_text: אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא סְבָרָא: מָר סָבַר, עֵד אֶחָד כִּי אָתֵי – לִשְׁבוּעָה אָתֵי, לְמָמוֹנָא לָא אָתֵי.
human_translation: If you wish, say logical reasoning, Sage, holds when one witness comes he comes to an oath. He does not come to money,
llm_translation: If you will say a reason: Master holds, one witness when he comes - he comes for an oath, he does not come for money.

hebrew_text: וְאִידַּךְ: אַטּוּ כִּי אָתוּ בַּהֲדֵי הֲדָדֵי, בְּחַד פּוּמָּא קָא מַסְהֲדִי? אֶלָּא מְצָרְפִינַן לְהוּ. הָכָא נָמֵי לִיצָרְפִינְהוּ.
human_translation: And the other Is that to say when they come together, they testify with one mouth? Rather, combine Here too, let combine
llm_translation: And the other opinion is: When they came before Hadadezer, were they testifying with one mouth? Rather, we reconcile them. Here too, let us reconcile them.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא קְרָא: ״אִם לוֹא יַגִּיד וְנָשָׂא עֲוֹנוֹ״,
human_translation: And if you wish, say a verse: “If he does not utter it, then he shall bear his iniquity”
llm_translation: And if you will say, let us bring a verse: "If he does not tell, he shall bear his iniquity."

hebrew_text: וּדְכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא כְּרַבָּנַן דִּפְלִיגִי עֲלֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן קׇרְחָה, וְהָכָא בְּאַקּוֹשֵׁי הַגָּדָה לִרְאִיָּה קָא מִיפַּלְגִי. מָר סָבַר: מַקְּשִׁינַן הַגָּדָה לִרְאִיָּה, וּמָר סָבַר: לָא מַקְּשִׁינַן.
human_translation: and everyone, in accordance with the Rabbis who disagree with Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korḥa, And here, they disagree with regard to statement is compared to observation Sage, holds we compare statement to observation. And Sage, holds we do not compare
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: And the general principle in the world is like the Rabbis who argued against Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korcha, and here in the difficulties of the Aggadah for clarification they argue. One Master holds: We pose difficulties in the Aggadah for clarification, and one Master holds: We do not pose difficulties.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְיָקִים הֲוָה מִשְׁתְּקִיד עֲלֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא לְמִסְמְכֵיהּ, וְלָא קָא מִיסְתַּיַּיע מִילְּתָא. יוֹמָא חַד הֲוָה יָתֵיב קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן,
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Elyakim was striving to ordain Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, and was not successful One day, was sitting before Rabbi Yoḥanan
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Eliekim was diligent in studying under Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Chanina, but he did not grasp the matter. One day he was sitting before Rabbi Yochanan,

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לְהוּ: מִי אִיכָּא דְּיָדַע הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן קׇרְחָה, אוֹ לָא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְיָקִים: דֵּין יָדַע. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לֵימָא אֵיזוֹ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לִיסְמְכֵיהּ מָר בְּרֵישָׁא. סַמְכֵיהּ.
human_translation: said to Is there who knows halakha in accordance with Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korḥa, or not? Rabbi Shimon ben Elyakim said to him: This knows. said to him: If so, let him say. said to him: Let the Master ordain him first; ordained
llm_translation: He said to them: Is there anyone who knows the halakha like Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korḥa or not? Rabbi Shimon ben Eliezer said to him: He knows the law. He said to him: Let us say who. He said to him: Let us rely on the Master at the beginning. He relied on him.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בְּנִי, אֱמוֹר לִי כֵּיצַד שָׁמַעְתָּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: כָּךְ שָׁמַעְתִּי, שֶׁמּוֹדֶה רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן קׇרְחָה לְרַבִּי נָתָן.
human_translation: said to him: My son, tell me what you heard. said to him: This is what I heard: That Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korḥa concedes to Rabbi Natan
llm_translation: He said to him: My son, tell me how did you hear? He said to him: This is how I heard, that Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korcha acknowledges to Rabbi Natan.

hebrew_text: אָמַר: לָזֶה הוּצְרַכְתִּי?! הַשְׁתָּא, וּמָה עִיקַּר רְאִיָּה בַּהֲדֵי הֲדָדֵי אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן קׇרְחָה ״לָא בָּעֵינַן״, הַגָּדָה מִיבַּעְיָא?
human_translation: said: For this I needed Now main observing Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korḥa says we do not need together, statement is necessary
llm_translation: He said: "For this did I need it?!" Now, what is the main point of seeing with regards to Hadadei? Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korcha said, "We do not require it," is a question of Aggadah?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הוֹאִיל וְעָלִיתָ, לֹא תֵּרֵד. אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ, גַּבְרָא רַבָּה, כֵּיוָן דְּאִיסְתְּמִיךְ – אִיסְתְּמִיךְ.
human_translation: said to him: Since you ascended, you will not descend, Rabbi Zeira said: Conclude from it a great man, once he is ordained, he is ordained.
llm_translation: He said to him: Since you have ascended, do not descend. Rabbi Zeira said: Learn from it, great man, once you have become established – remain established.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אָבִין אָמַר רַב: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן קׇרְחָה, בֵּין בְּקַרְקָעוֹת בֵּין בְּמִטַּלְטְלִין.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Avin says Rav says: halakha in accordance with Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korḥa both with regard to land with regard to movable property.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Chiya bar Avin said Rav: The halacha is according to Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korcha, whether in pits or in hanging vessels.

hebrew_text: עוּלָּא אָמַר: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן קׇרְחָה בְּקַרְקָעוֹת, אֲבָל לֹא בְּמִטַּלְטְלִין.
human_translation: Ulla says: halakha in accordance with Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korḥa with regard to land, but not with regard to movable property,
llm_translation: Oula said: The halakha is according to Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korcha in matters of pits, but not in matters of hanging vessels.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: הֲלָכָה, מִכְּלָל דִּפְלִיגִי? וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא אָמַר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַב: מוֹדִים חֲכָמִים לְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן קׇרְחָה בְּעֵדוּת קַרְקַע!
human_translation: Abaye said to halakha by inference that they disagree But doesn’t Rabbi Abba say Rav Huna says Rav says: The Rabbis concede to Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korḥa with regard to testimony land?
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: Halacha, from the principle that they argue? And Rabbi Abba said in the name of Rav Huna who said in the name of Rav: The Sages concede to Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korcha in the matter of testimony regarding land!

hebrew_text: וְתָנֵי רַב אִידִי בַּר אָבִין בִּנְזִיקִין דְּבֵי קַרְנָא: מוֹדִין חֲכָמִים לְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן קׇרְחָה בְּעֵדוּת בְּכוֹר, וּבְעֵדוּת קַרְקַע, וּבְעֵדוּת חֲזָקָה, וְכֵן שֶׁבַּבֵּן וְשֶׁבַּבַּת.
human_translation: And Rav Idi bar Avin teaches in damages at the school of Karna: The Rabbis concede to Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korḥa with regard to testimony firstborn and with regard to testimony land, and with regard to testimony presumptive ownership And so of a boy or of a girl,
llm_translation: And it was taught: Rav Idi bar Avin taught in the laws of damages in the study hall of Karnah: The sages concede to Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korcha in the testimony of a firstborn, and in the testimony of land, and in the testimony of possession, and likewise in the case of a son and a daughter.

hebrew_text: גַּבְרָא אַגַּבְרָא קָא רָמֵית? מָר סָבַר פְּלִיגִי, וּמָר סָבַר לָא פְּלִיגִי.
human_translation: Are you setting man against man? Sage, holds disagree and Sage, holds they do not disagree.
llm_translation: A man against a man are you raising? One Master holds they argue, and one Master holds they do not argue.

hebrew_text: מַאי ״וְכֵן שֶׁבַּבֵּן וְשֶׁבַּבַּת״? אִילֵּימָא: אֶחָד אוֹמֵר אַחַת בְּגַבָּהּ, וְאֶחָד אוֹמֵר אַחַת בִּכְרֵיסָהּ? הַאי חֲצִי דָבָר וַחֲצִי עֵדוּת הוּא!
human_translation: And so of a boy or of a girl: What If we say one says one on her back and one says one on her abdomen, this is half a matter and half a testimony.
llm_translation: What is meant by "both in the son and in the daughter"? If you say, one says one in her height, and one says one in her waist? This is half a matter and half a testimony!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, אֶחָד אוֹמֵר: שְׁתַּיִם בְּגַבָּהּ, וְאֶחָד אוֹמֵר: שְׁתַּיִם בִּכְרֵיסָהּ.
human_translation: Rather, one says two on her back, and one says two on her abdomen.
llm_translation: Rather, one says: "Two cubits in its height," and one says: "Two cubits in its width."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: אֲנָא אָמֵינָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּעוּלָּא: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן קׇרְחָה, בֵּין בְּקַרְקָעוֹת בֵּין בְּמִטַּלְטְלִין. וְרַבָּנַן דְּאָתוּ מִמָּחוֹזָא אָמְרִי: אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב: בַּקַּרְקָעוֹת – אִין, אֲבָל לָא בְּמִטַּלְטְלִין.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: I say in the name of Ulla halakha in accordance with Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korḥa both with regard to land and with regard to movable property. But the Sages who came from Meḥoza say Rabbi Zeira says in the name of Rav: With regard to land is but not with regard to movable property.
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: I believe in the name of Ulla: the halakha is according to Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korḥa, whether in pits or in hanging vessels. And the Rabbis who came from the district said: Rabbi Zeira said in the name of Rav: in pits – no, but not in hanging vessels.

hebrew_text: רַב לְטַעְמֵיהּ, דְּאָמַר רַב: הוֹדָאָה אַחַר הוֹדָאָה, הוֹדָאָה אַחַר הַלְוָאָה – מִצְטָרְפִי.
human_translation: Rav to his reasoning, as Rav says: an admission following an admission an admission following a loan are combined
llm_translation: Rav according to his reasoning, as Rav said: Acknowledgment after acknowledgment, acknowledgment after borrowing - they combine.

hebrew_text: הַלְוָאָה אַחַר הַלְוָאָה, הַלְוָאָה אַחַר הוֹדָאָה – לָא מִצְטָרְפִי.
human_translation: a loan following a loan a loan following an admission are not combined.
llm_translation: Loan after loan, loan after acknowledgment - they do not combine.

hebrew_text: אַשְׁכְּחֵיהּ רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק לְרַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַאי שְׁנָא הַלְוָאָה אַחַר הַלְוָאָה דְּלָא? דְּמָנֶה דְּקָא חָזֵי הַאי, לָא קָא חָזֵי הַאי. הוֹדָאָה אַחַר הוֹדָאָה נָמֵי – אַמָּנֶה דְּקָא מוֹדֵי קַמֵּי הַאי, לָא מוֹדֵי קַמֵּי הַאי?
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak encountered Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua. He said to him: What is different a loan following a loan, which not as the one hundred dinars that this saw, that did not see? an admission following an admission as well, the one hundred dinars about which admitted in the presence of this he did not admit in the presence of that
llm_translation: He found Rav Nachman the son of Yitzchak to Rav Huna the son of Rabbah bar Yehoshua. He said to him: What is the difference between one admission after another admission that it is not? Because this one, he sees this one, he does not see this one.
