Also, one acknowledgment after another acknowledgment - if this one acknowledges before this one, they do not acknowledge before this one?

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר לֵיהּ לְהַאי בָּתְרָא: בְּהַאי מָנֶה דְּאוֹדַיי לֵיהּ קַמָּךְ, אוֹדַיי לֵיהּ נָמֵי קַמֵּי פְּלוֹנִי.
human_translation: where said to this last With regard to the one hundred dinars that I admitted in your presence, I admitted them in the presence of so-and-so, as well.
llm_translation: He said to him: To this daughter-in-law: with this mana that I give you, stand before him, stand before so-and-so.

hebrew_text: אַכַּתִּי, בָּתְרָא יָדַע, קַמָּא לָא יָדַע.
human_translation: Still, the last knows the first does not know
llm_translation: Akkati, batra yada, kama la yada.

hebrew_text: דַּהֲדַר אָזֵיל, אָמַר לֵיהּ לְקַמָּא: הַאי מָנֶה דְּאוֹדַיי לֵיהּ קַמָּךְ, אוֹדַיי לֵיהּ נָמֵי קַמֵּי פְּלוֹנִי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: תָּנוּחַ דַּעְתְּךָ שֶׁהִתְנַחְתָּ אֶת דַּעְתִּי.
human_translation: where, went back said to the first those one hundred dinars that I admitted in your presence, I admitted them in the presence of so-and-so as well. said to him: May your mind be settled, as you have settled my mind
llm_translation: I will go back, he said to him: this maneh that I owe you, I will pay it to so-and-so in front of you. He said to him: may your mind be at ease, for you have put my mind at ease.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַאי נִיחוּתָא? דְּרָבָא, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַב שֵׁשֶׁת, שְׁדָא בַּהּ נַרְגָּא – לָאו הַיְינוּ הוֹדָאָה אַחַר הַלְוָאָה?
human_translation: said to him: What is settling As Rava, and some say Rav Sheshet, threw an ax at isn’t this an admission following a loan?
llm_translation: He said to him: What is the ruling? Of Rava, and some say Rav Sheshet, that a candle was placed in it - is this not acknowledgment after borrowing?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הַיְינוּ דִּשְׁמִיעַ לִי עֲלַיְיכוּ, דְּרָמֵיתוּ דִּיקְלֵי וְזָקְפִיתוּ לְהוּ.
human_translation: said to him: This is what I heard about you that you knock down palm trees and erect them,
llm_translation: He said to him: "This is what I heard about you, that you bent palm trees and made them stand."

hebrew_text: נְהַרְדָּעֵי אָמְרִי: בֵּין הוֹדָאָה אַחַר הוֹדָאָה, בֵּין הוֹדָאָה אַחַר הַלְוָאָה, בֵּין הַלְוָאָה אַחַר הַלְוָאָה, בֵּין הַלְוָאָה אַחַר הוֹדָאָה – מִצְטָרְפוֹת. כְּמַאן? כְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן קׇרְחָה.
human_translation: of Neharde’a say: Whether an admission following an admission, or an admission following a loan, or a loan following a loan, or a loan following an admission, are combined. In accordance with whose in accordance with Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korḥa,
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: Nehardaei said: Between acknowledgment after acknowledgment, between acknowledgment after loan, between loan after loan, between loan after acknowledgment - they combine. According to whom? According to Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korcha.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: עֵדוּת הַמַּכְחֶשֶׁת זוֹ אֶת זוֹ בִּבְדִיקוֹת, כְּשֵׁרָה בְּדִינֵי מָמוֹנוֹת.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says: Testimony who contradict each other in examination is valid in monetary law,
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said: Testimony that contradicts one another through examinations, valid in monetary cases.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: מִסְתַּבְּרָא מִילְּתֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוּדָה בְּאֶחָד אוֹמֵר ״בְּאַרְנָקִי שְׁחוֹרָה״, וְאֶחָד אוֹמֵר ״בְּאַרְנָקִי לְבָנָה״. אֲבָל אֶחָד אוֹמֵר ״מָנֶה שָׁחוֹר״, וְאֶחָד אוֹמֵר ״מָנֶה לָבָן״ – אֵין מִצְטָרְפִין.
human_translation: Rava says: The statement of Rav Yehuda is reasonable in one says: in a black purse [ be’arnaki ], and one says: in a white purse. But one says: a black coin, and one says: a white coin, are not combined.
llm_translation: Rava said: It is reasonable the matter of Rav Yehudah, one says "with a black purse," and one says "with a white purse." But if one says "a black vessel," and one says "a white vessel" - they do not combine.

hebrew_text: וְאַרְנָקִי שְׁחוֹרָה בְּדִינֵי נְפָשׁוֹת לָא? וְהָאָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: אֶחָד אוֹמֵר ״בְּסַיִיף הֲרָגוֹ״ וְאֶחָד אוֹמֵר ״בַּאֲרִירָן הֲרָגוֹ״ – אֵין זֶה ״נָכוֹן״; אֶחָד אוֹמֵר ״כֵּלָיו שְׁחוֹרִים״ וְאֶחָד אוֹמֵר ״כֵּלָיו לְבָנִים״ – הֲרֵי זֶה ״נָכוֹן״.
human_translation: And a black purse in capital law, not But doesn’t Rav Ḥisda say: one says: killed with a sword, and one says: killed with an ariran , this is not congruent one says: garments black, and one says: garments white, this is congruent
llm_translation: And a black wallet in cases of capital punishment not? And it was said by Rav Ḥisda: One says, "With a sword they killed him," and one says, "With a dagger they killed him" - this is not correct; one says, "His kidneys were black," and one says, "His kidneys were white" - this is correct.

hebrew_text: גַּבְרָא אַגַּבְרָא קָא רָמֵית?
human_translation: Are you setting man against man?
llm_translation: A man against a man, are you raising?

hebrew_text: נְהַרְדָּעֵי אָמְרִי: אֲפִילּוּ אֶחָד אוֹמֵר ״מָנֶה שָׁחוֹר״, וְאֶחָד אוֹמֵר ״מָנֶה לָבָן״ – מִצְטָרְפִים.
human_translation: of Neharde’a say: Even one says a black coin and one says a white coin are combined.
llm_translation: The scholars of Nehardea said: Even if one says "a black mina" and another says "a white mina" - they combine.

hebrew_text: כְּמַאן? כְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן קׇרְחָה? אֵימַר דְּשָׁמְעַתְּ לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן קׇרְחָה הֵיכָא דְּלָא מַכְחֲשִׁי אַהֲדָדֵי, הֵיכָא דְּמַכְחֲשִׁי אַהֲדָדֵי מִי אָמַר?
human_translation: In accordance with whose in accordance with Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korḥa, Say that you heard Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korḥa where they do not contradict each other; where they contradict each other, did he say
llm_translation: As whom? As Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korcha? Say that you heard from Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korcha - where is it that they do not contradict each other, and where is it that they do contradict each other, who said?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא הוּא דְּאָמַר כִּי הַאי תַּנָּא, דְּתַנְיָא: אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר: לֹא נֶחְלְקוּ בֵּית שַׁמַּאי וּבֵית הִלֵּל עַל שְׁתֵּי כִּיתֵּי עֵדִים, שֶׁאַחַת אוֹמֶרֶת מָאתַיִם וְאַחַת אוֹמֶרֶת מָנֶה, שֶׁיֵּשׁ בִּכְלַל מָאתַיִם מָנֶה.
human_translation: Rather, stated in accordance with that tanna , as it is taught Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel do not disagree with regard to two sets of witnesses, where one says two hundred and one says one hundred dinars. as one hundred dinars is within two hundred,
llm_translation: Rather, it is as he said, for this Tanna, as it was taught: Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar said: Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel did not disagree regarding two groups of witnesses, one saying two hundred and one saying a hundred, for two hundred is included in a hundred.

hebrew_text: עַל מָה נֶחְלְקוּ? עַל כַּת אַחַת, שֶׁבֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: נֶחְלְקָה עֵדוּתָן, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: יֵשׁ בִּכְלַל מָאתַיִם מָנֶה.
human_translation: With regard to what do they disagree? over one set As Beit Shammai say their testimony is divided. And Beit Hillel say: One hundred dinars is within two hundred.
llm_translation: On what do they argue? On one point, for Beit Shammai say: their testimony is divided, and Beit Hillel say: there are in total two hundred mana.

hebrew_text: אֶחָד אוֹמֵר: ״חָבִית שֶׁל יַיִן״, וְאֶחָד אוֹמֵר: ״חָבִית שֶׁל שֶׁמֶן״. הֲוָה עוֹבָדָא, וְאָתֵי לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי אַמֵּי. חַיְּיבֵיהּ רַבִּי אַמֵּי לְשַׁלּוֹמֵי לֵיהּ חָבִיתָא דְחַמְרָא מִיגּוֹ חָבִיתָא דְמִשְׁחָא.
human_translation: one says a barrel of wine, and one says a barrel of oil, there was an incident, and it came before Rabbi Ami. Rabbi Ami deemed liable to pay a barrel of wine out of a barrel of oil,
llm_translation: One says: "a barrel of wine," and one says: "a barrel of oil." There was an incident, and they came before Rabbi Ammi. Rabbi Ammi obligated him to pay him a barrel of wine from the best quality, as he said a barrel of wine.

hebrew_text: כְּמַאן? כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר? אֵימַר דְּאָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר הֵיכָא דְּיֵשׁ בִּכְלַל מָאתַיִם מָנֶה, כִּי הַאי גַּוְונָא מִי אָמַר?
human_translation: In accordance with whose in accordance with Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar? Say that Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar said where one hundred dinars is within two hundred; a case like this, did he say
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "K'man? K'Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar? Eimar d'amar Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar heicha d'yesh bichlal matayim mane, ki hai gavvana mi amar?" English translation: "According to whom? According to Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar? Say that Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar, where there is included two hundred mana, for who said this estimation?"

hebrew_text: לָא צְרִיכָא, לִדְמֵי.
human_translation: No, necessary with regard to monetary value,
llm_translation: Not necessary, for it is similar.

hebrew_text: אֶחָד אוֹמֵר: ״בִּדְיוֹטָא הָעֶלְיוֹנָה״, וְאֶחָד אוֹמֵר: ״בִּדְיוֹטָא הַתַּחְתּוֹנָה״. אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: מַעֲשֶׂה בָּא לִפְנֵי רַבִּי, וְצֵירַף עֵדוּתָן.
human_translation: one says on the upper floor [ badeyota ] and one says on the lower floor, Rabbi Ḥanina says an incident came before Rabbi and he combined their testimonies.
llm_translation: One says: "In the upper commoner," and one says: "In the lower commoner." Rabbi Chanina said: A case came before Rabbi, and he corroborated their testimony.

hebrew_text: וּמִנַּיִין לִכְשֶׁיֵּצֵא כּוּ׳. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן, מִנַּיִין לִכְשֶׁיֵּצֵא לֹא יֹאמַר: הֲרֵינִי מְזַכֶּה וַחֲבֵירַי מְחַיְּיבִין, אֲבָל מָה אֶעֱשֶׂה שֶׁחֲבֵירַי רַבּוּ עָלַי? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״לֹא תֵלֵךְ רָכִיל בְּעַמֶּיךָ״, וְאוֹמֵר ״הוֹלֵךְ רָכִיל מְגַלֶּה סוֹד״.
human_translation: And from where when leaves The Sages taught From where when leaves he should not say: I deemed exempt and my colleagues deemed liable, but what can I do, as my colleagues outnumbered me The verse states: “You shall not go as a talebearer among your people” and it says: “One who goes about as a talebearer reveals secrets”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And from where do we derive that when one leaves court, he should not say, "I am acquitting myself, and my colleagues are holding the defendant liable," but rather, "What shall I do, since my colleagues are more numerous than I?" The Rabbis taught: We learn this from the verse, "You shall not go about as a talebearer among your people," and it also says, "One who goes about as a talebearer reveals secrets."

hebrew_text: הָהוּא תַּלְמִידָא דִּנְפַק עֲלֵיהּ קָלָא דְּגַלִּי מִילְּתָא דְּאִיתְּמַר בֵּי מִדְרְשָׁא בָּתַר עֶשְׂרִין וְתַרְתֵּין שְׁנִין, אַפְּקֵיהּ רַב אַמֵּי מִבֵּי מִדְרְשָׁא. אֲמַר: ״דֵּין גָּלֵי רָזַיָּא.״
human_translation: a certain student, about whom a rumor emerged that he revealed a statement that was stated in the study hall twenty-two years after Rav Ami removed him from the study hall said: This is a revealer of secrets
llm_translation: That disciple who went out with a loud voice revealing the secret matter that was discussed in the study hall after twenty-two years, Rav Ammi expelled him from the study hall. He said: "Revealer of secrets, go to the market!"

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ כׇּל זְמַן שֶׁמֵּבִיא רְאָיָה – סוֹתֵר אֶת הַדִּין. אָמַר לוֹ: ״כׇּל רְאָיוֹת שֶׁיֵּשׁ לְךָ הָבֵא מִיכָּן עַד שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם״. מָצָא בְּתוֹךְ שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם – סוֹתֵר, לְאַחַר שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם – אֵינוֹ סוֹתֵר.
human_translation: Any time brings proof, he can overturn the verdict said to Bring all the proofs that you have from now until thirty days he found within thirty days, he can overturn after thirty days, he cannot overturn
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: "As long as one brings evidence - he nullifies the judgment." He said to him: "All the evidence that you have, bring from here until thirty days." If he found it within thirty days - he nullifies it, after thirty days - he does not nullify it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל: מָה יַעֲשֶׂה זֶה שֶׁלֹּא מָצָא בְּתוֹךְ שְׁלֹשִׁים, וּמָצָא לְאַחַר שְׁלֹשִׁים?
human_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said: what should this who did not find within thirty but found after thirty have done?
llm_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said: What should one do if he did not find within thirty, but found after thirty?

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ: ״הָבֵא עֵדִים״, וְאָמַר: ״אֵין לִי עֵדִים״. אָמַר: ״הָבֵא רְאָיָה״, וְאָמַר: ״אֵין לִי רְאָיָה״. וּלְאַחַר זְמַן הֵבִיא רְאָיָה וּמָצָא עֵדִים – הֲרֵי זֶה אֵינוֹ כְּלוּם.
human_translation: said to Bring witnesses, and said: I have no witnesses, said Bring a proof, and he said: I have no proof, and he later brought a proof or found witnesses, this nothing.
llm_translation: He said to him: "Bring witnesses," and he said: "I have no witnesses." He said: "Bring evidence," and he said: "I have no evidence." And after some time he brought evidence and found witnesses - this is not considered as nothing.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל: מָה יַעֲשֶׂה זֶה שֶׁלֹּא הָיָה יוֹדֵעַ שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ עֵדִים, וּמָצָא עֵדִים? לֹא הָיָה יוֹדֵעַ שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ רְאָיָה, וּמָצָא רְאָיָה?
human_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said: What should this who did not know that he has witnesses and found witnesses, did not know that he has a proof and found proof, have done?
llm_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said: What should one do if he did not know that he had witnesses, and then found witnesses? He did not know that he had evidence, and then found evidence?

hebrew_text: רָאָה שֶׁמִּתְחַיֵּיב בַּדִּין, וְאָמַר: ״קָרְבוּ פְּלוֹנִי וּפְלוֹנִי וִיעִידוּנִי״, אוֹ שֶׁהוֹצִיא רְאָיָה מִתַּחַת פּוּנְדָּתוֹ – הֲרֵי זֶה אֵינוֹ כְּלוּם.
human_translation: he saw that he deemed liable in the judgment, and said: Bring so-and-so and so-and-so, and they will testify on my behalf, or he pulled out a proof from under his belt [ pundato ], that this is nothing.
llm_translation: He saw that he is liable in judgment, and he said: "Bring so-and-so and so-and-so close and let them testify for me," or he brought forth a witness from under his cloak - this is nothing.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל. וְאָמַר רַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא: אֵין הֲלָכָה כְּדִבְרֵי חֲכָמִים.
human_translation: Rabba bar Rav Huna says: halakha in accordance with Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel. And Rabba bar Rav Huna says: halakha not in accordance with the statement of the Rabbis.
llm_translation: Gemara: Rabba bar Rav Huna said: The halakha is according to Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel. And Rabba bar Rav Huna said: The halakha is not according to the words of the Sages.

hebrew_text: פְּשִׁיטָא! כֵּיוָן דְּאָמַר הֲלָכָה כְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, מִמֵּילָא יָדַעְנָא דְּאֵין הֲלָכָה כַּחֲכָמִים.
human_translation: obvious? Since he says halakha in accordance with Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, we know by ourselves that halakha not in accordance with the Rabbis.
llm_translation: It is obvious! Since he said the halakha follows Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, from the outset we knew that the halakha does not follow the sages.

hebrew_text: מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: הָנֵי מִילֵּי לְכַתְּחִילָּה, אֲבָל דִּיעֲבַד שַׁפִּיר דָּמֵי, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן, דְּאִי עָבֵיד – מַהְדְּרִינַן לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Lest you say this statement, ab initio , but after the fact, valid, teaches us that if acts we send back
llm_translation: What is the reasoning: these matters initially, but retroactively, it is good, the price is heard to us, that if he does it - we return it to him.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ: הָבֵא עֵדִים כּוּ׳, אָמַר רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל כּוּ׳. אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הֲלָכָה כְּדִבְרֵי חֲכָמִים. וְאָמַר רַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אֵין הֲלָכָה כְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל.
human_translation: said to Bring witnesses, Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said Rabba bar Rav Huna says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: halakha in accordance with the statement of the Rabbis. And Rabba bar Rav Huna says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: halakha not in accordance with Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel.
llm_translation: He said to him: "Bring witnesses, etc." Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said, etc. Rabbah bar Rav Huna said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: The halakha follows the words of the Sages. And Rabbah bar Rav Huna said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: The halakha does not follow Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel.

hebrew_text: פְּשִׁיטָא! כֵּיוָן דְּאָמַר הֲלָכָה כְּדִבְרֵי חֲכָמִים, מִמֵּילָא יָדַעְנָא דְּאֵין הֲלָכָה כְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל.
human_translation: obvious? Since he says halakha in accordance with the statement of the Rabbis, we know by ourselves that halakha is not in accordance with Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel.
llm_translation: It is obvious! Since he said the halakha follows the words of the sages, automatically we know that the halakha does not follow Rabbi Shimon ben Gamliel.

hebrew_text: הָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן, דִּבְהָהִיא אֵין הֲלָכָה כְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל; הָא בְּכוּלְּהוּ – הֲלָכָה כְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל.
human_translation: This teaches us that with regard to that halakha not in accordance with Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel; but with regard to all halakha in accordance with Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel.
llm_translation: This is what we are hearing, that in that matter the halakha is not like Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel; but in all of them - the halakha is like Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel.

hebrew_text: לְאַפּוֹקֵי מֵהָא דְּאָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁשָּׁנָה רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל בְּמִשְׁנָתֵנוּ, הֲלָכָה כְּמוֹתוֹ, חוּץ מֵעָרֵב וְצַיְדָן וּרְאָיָה אַחֲרוֹנָה.
human_translation: to the exclusion of that which Rabba bar bar Ḥanna says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Anywhere that Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel taught in our Mishna, halakha in accordance with his except for guarantor, and Tzaidan, and evidence final
llm_translation: To go out from that which Rabba bar bar Ḥana said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: In every place that Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel changed in our Mishnah, the halakha is like him, except for Erev, Tzaidan, and the last Re'ayah.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא יָנוֹקָא דְּתַבְעוּהּ לְדִינָא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן. אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: אִית לְךָ סָהֲדֵי? אֲמַר לְהוּ: לָא. אִית לָךְ רְאָיָה? אֲמַר לְהוּ: לָא. חַיְּיבֵיהּ רַב נַחְמָן.
human_translation: a certain child who was taken to court before Rav Naḥman. They said to him: Do you have witnesses said to them: No. Do you have evidence? said to them: No. Rav Naḥman deemed him liable,
llm_translation: That young man who came to be judged before Rav Nachman. They said to him: Do you have witnesses? He said to them: No. Do you have evidence? He said to them: No. Rav Nachman ruled against him.

hebrew_text: הֲוָה קָא בָכֵי וְאָזֵיל. שַׁמְעוּהּ הָנָךְ אִינָשֵׁי, אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: אֲנַן יָדְעִינַן בְּמִילֵּי דַּאֲבוּךְ. אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: בְּהָא אֲפִילּוּ רַבָּנַן מוֹדוּ, דְּיָנוֹקָא בְּמִילֵּי דַּאֲבוּהּ לָא יָדַע.
human_translation: was walking and crying. These people heard him, said to him: We know about the matters of your father Rav Naḥman said: In this, even the Rabbis concede as a child does not know about the matters of his father.
llm_translation: He was crying and went out. They heard him, people there, said to him: We know the words of your father. Rav Nachman said: In this even the Rabbis agree, that a baby does not understand the words of his father.

hebrew_text: הָהִיא אִיתְּתָא דִּנְפַק שְׁטָרָא מִתּוּתֵי יְדַהּ, אֲמַרָה (לֵיהּ): יָדַעְנָא בְּהַאי שְׁטָרָא דִּפְרִיעַ הֲוָה. הֵימְנַהּ רַב נַחְמָן.
human_translation: a certain woman from whose possession note emerged, She said to I know that this note was repaid. Rav Naḥman deemed her credible
llm_translation: That woman who went out with a document from the hands of her husband, she said to him: "I knew with this document that it was forged." Rav Nachman trusted her.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא לְרַב נַחְמָן: כְּמַאן? כְּרַבִּי, דְּאָמַר אוֹתִיּוֹת נִקְנוֹת בִּמְסִירָה.
human_translation: Rava said to Rav Naḥman: In accordance with whose in accordance with Rabbi who says letters, are acquired by transferring
llm_translation: He said to him Rava to Rav Nachman: Like whom? Like Rabbi, who said that testimonies are acquired through transfer.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: שָׁאנֵי הָכָא, דְּאִי בָּעֲיָא – קְלָתֵיהּ.
human_translation: said to him: here it is different. as, if she had wanted she burned it.
llm_translation: He said to him: It is different here, for if he wants - his voice.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְאָמְרִי: לָא הֵימְנַהּ רַב נַחְמָן. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא לְרַב נַחְמָן: וְהָא אִי בָּעֲיָא —
human_translation: Some say Rav Naḥman did not deem her credible. Rava said to Rav Naḥman: But if she had wanted
llm_translation: There are those who say: Rav Nachman did not trust her. Rava said to Rav Nachman: But if she wants—

hebrew_text: קְלָתֵיהּ!
human_translation: she burned it.
llm_translation: The voice of his voice!

hebrew_text: כֵּיוָן דְּאִיתַּחְזַק בְּבֵי דִינָא, ״אִיבַּעְיָא קְלָתֵיהּ״ לָא אָמְרִינַן.
human_translation: Since was ratified in court, we do not say if she had wanted she burned it.
llm_translation: Since he has established himself in the court, "his voice is not heard."

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רָבָא לְרַב נַחְמָן: סִימְפּוֹן שֶׁיֵּשׁ עָלָיו עֵדִים – יִתְקַיֵּים בְּחוֹתְמָיו. אֵין עָלָיו עֵדִים, וְיָצָא מִתַּחַת יְדֵי שָׁלִישׁ, אוֹ שֶׁיָּצָא אַחַר חִיתּוּם שְׁטָרוֹת – כָּשֵׁר. אַלְמָא שָׁלִישׁ מְהֵימַן!
human_translation: Rava raised an objection to Rav Naḥman A receipt [ simfon ] upon which witnesses is ratified by its signatories. there are no witnesses on it, but emerged from the possession of a third party or it emerged after the signing of the documents, valid. Apparently, a third party is deemed credible,
llm_translation: Rava raised an objection to Rav Nachman: A document that has witnesses signed on it - it is valid with their signatures. If it does not have witnesses signed on it, and it went out of the possession of the third party, or if it went out after the sealing of the documents - it is valid. This proves that a third party is trusted!

hebrew_text: תְּיוּבְתָּא דְּרַב נַחְמָן, תְּיוּבְתָּא.
human_translation: The refutation of Rav Naḥman is a conclusive refutation.
llm_translation: The goodness of Rav Nachman, the goodness.

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא רַב דִּימִי, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: לְעוֹלָם מֵבִיא רְאָיָה וְסוֹתֵר, עַד שֶׁיִּסְתַּתֵּם טַעֲנוֹתָיו וְיֹאמַר: קִרְבוּ פְּלוֹנִי וּפְלוֹנִי וְהַעִידוּנִי.
human_translation: When Rav Dimi came Rabbi Yoḥanan said: can always bring a proof and overturn until his claims are stopped up, and he says: Come, so-and-so and so-and-so, and testify on my behalf,
llm_translation: When Rav Dimi came, Rabbi Yochanan said: Always bring proof and refute until his claims are established, and he will say, "Bring so-and-so and so-and-so close and have them testify for me."

hebrew_text: הָא גוּפַאּ קַשְׁיָא: אָמְרַתְּ ״יִסְתַּתֵּם טַעֲנוֹתָיו״ – אֲתָאן לְרַבָּנַן, וַהֲדַר אָמְרַתְּ ״קִרְבוּ אִישׁ פְּלוֹנִי וּפְלוֹנִי וְהַעִידוּנִי״ – אֲתָאן לְרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל.
human_translation: This matter itself difficult. you say: his claims are stopped up, we arrive at, the Rabbis, And you then say: come, so-and-so and so-and-so, and testify on my behalf, we arrive at Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel
llm_translation: The matter is difficult: You said, "You have wearied the Lord with your words" - the sages came, and then you said, "Bring near to me so-and-so and so-and-so, and let them testify for me" - Rabbi Shimon ben Gamliel came.

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא: כּוּלַּהּ רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, וּפָרוֹשֵׁי קָא מְפָרֵשׁ? מַאי ״עַד שֶׁיִּסְתַּתֵּם טַעֲנוֹתָיו״? עַד שֶׁיֹּאמַר: קִרְבוּ פְּלוֹנִי וּפְלוֹנִי וְהַעִידוּנִי. וְהָא אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁשָּׁנָה רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל בְּמִשְׁנָתֵינוּ הֲלָכָה כְּמוֹתוֹ, חוּץ מֵעָרֵב וְצַיְדָן וּרְאָיָה אַחֲרוֹנָה?
human_translation: And if you would say the entire Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, and is explaining What is Until his claims are stopped up? Until he says: Come, so-and-so and so-and-so, and testify on my behalf, But doesn’t Rabba bar bar Ḥana say Rabbi Yoḥanan says anywhere that Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel taught in our Mishna, halakha in accordance with his except for guarantor, and Tzaidan, and evidence final
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And if you will say: The entire Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, and the Pharisees are explaining? What is "until his claims are established"? Until he says: Bring so-and-so and so-and-so close and have them testify for me. But didn't Rabba bar bar Ḥana say that Rabbi Yoḥanan said: In every place where Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel changed a halakha in our Mishnah, the halakha follows his opinion, except for Erev, Tzaidan, and the last sighting?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, כִּי אֲתָא רַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר יְהוּדָה, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: לְעוֹלָם מֵבִיא רְאָיָה וְסוֹתֵר, עַד שֶׁיִּסְתַּתֵּם טַעֲנוֹתָיו וְיֹאמְרוּ לוֹ: ״הָבֵא עֵדִים״, וְאוֹמֵר: ״אֵין לִי עֵדִים״. ״הָבֵא רְאָיָה״, וְאוֹמֵר: ״אֵין לִי רְאָיָה״. אֲבָל בָּאוּ עֵדִים מִמְּדִינַת הַיָּם, אוֹ שֶׁהָיְתָה דִּיסַקַּיָּא שֶׁל אָבִיו מוּפְקֶדֶת בְּיַד אַחֵר – הֲרֵי זֶה מֵבִיא רְאָיָה וְסוֹתֵר.
human_translation: Rather, When Rav Shmuel bar Yehuda came Rabbi Yoḥanan says: One can always bring a proof and overturn until his claims are stopped up, and say to him: Bring witnesses, and he says: I have no witnesses, Bring evidence, and he says: I have no evidence. But witnesses came from overseas, or there was a saddlebag [ disakkaya ] of his father’s deposited by another he can bring evidence and overturn
llm_translation: Rather, when Rav Shmuel bar Yehudah came, Rabbi Yochanan said: One should always bring proof and then refute, until his claims are silenced and they say to him: "Bring witnesses," and he says: "I have no witnesses." "Bring evidence," and he says: "I have no evidence." But if witnesses come from overseas, or if his father's promissory note is held by another – this one brings proof and refutes.

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא רַב דִּימִי, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הַתּוֹקֵף אֶת חֲבֵירוֹ בַּדִּין, אֶחָד אוֹמֵר ״נִדּוֹן כָּאן״, וְאֶחָד אוֹמֵר ״נֵלֵךְ לִמְקוֹם הַוַּועַד״ – כּוֹפִין אוֹתוֹ וְיֵלֵךְ לִמְקוֹם הַוַּועַד.
human_translation: When Rav Dimi came Rabbi Yoḥanan says: one who attacks another in judgment, one says: Let us go to court here and one says: Let us go to the place of the Assembly, is compelled to go to the place of the Assembly.
llm_translation: When Rav Dimi came, Rabbi Yochanan said: One who confronts his fellow in court, one says "we shall be judged here," and one says "let us go to the appointed place" - they force him to go to the appointed place.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לְפָנָיו רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: רַבִּי, מִי שֶׁנּוֹשֶׁה בַּחֲבֵירוֹ מָנֶה, יוֹצִיא מָנֶה עַל מָנֶה? אֶלָּא, כּוֹפִין אוֹתוֹ וְדָן בְּעִירוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar said before him: My teacher, must one who claims one hundred dinars from another spend one hundred dinars for one hundred dinars Rather, is compelled to be judged in his city.
llm_translation: He said before him, Rabbi Elazar: Rabbi, one who lends to his fellow a Maneh, does he collect a Maneh upon a Maneh? Rather, we compel him and judge in his city.

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר נָמֵי: אָמַר רַב סָפְרָא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: שְׁנֵים שֶׁנִּתְעַצְּמוּ בַּדִּין, אֶחָד אוֹמֵר: ״נִדּוֹן כָּאן״, וְאֶחָד אוֹמֵר: ״נֵלֵךְ לִמְקוֹם הַוַּועַד״ – כּוֹפִין אוֹתוֹ וְדָן בְּעִירוֹ. וְאִם הוּצְרַךְ דָּבָר לִשְׁאוֹל – כּוֹתְבִין וְשׁוֹלְחִין.
human_translation: It was also stated Rav Safra says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: two who were struggling in judgment, one says: Let us go to court here, and one says: Let us go to the place of the Assembly, is compelled to be judged in his city. And if needs to ask matter, write and sends
llm_translation: It was stated: Rav Safra said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: Two who are in dispute in a legal matter, one says, "Let us be judged here," and one says, "Let us go to the appointed place" - they force him and judge in his city. And if there is a need to inquire about something - they write and send.

hebrew_text: וְאִם אָמַר: ״כִּתְבוּ וּתְנוּ לִי מֵאֵיזֶה טַעַם דַּנְתּוּנִי״ – כּוֹתְבִין וְנוֹתְנִין לוֹ.
human_translation: And if says Write for what reason you judged me and give to me, write and give to him.
llm_translation: "And if he said, 'Write and give me from what reason you judged me' - we write and give to him."

hebrew_text: וְהַיְּבָמָה, הוֹלֶכֶת אַחַר הַיָּבָם לְהַתִּירָהּ.
human_translation: And a woman whose husband had a brother, died childless [ vehayevama ], follows her brother-in-law [ hayavam ] to free her
llm_translation: And the yevamah, goes after the yavam to permit her.

hebrew_text: עַד כַּמָּה? אָמַר רַבִּי אַמֵּי: אֲפִילּוּ מִטְּבֶרְיָא לְצִפּוֹרִי.
human_translation: How far Rabbi Ami says: Even from Tiberias to Tzippori.
llm_translation: Until when? Rabbi Ammi said: Even from Tiberias to Tzippori.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא: מַאי קְרָא? ״וְקָרְאוּ לוֹ זִקְנֵי עִירוֹ״, וְלֹא זִקְנֵי עִירָהּ.
human_translation: Rav Kahana says: What is the verse “Then the elders of his city shall call him, and not the elders of her city,
llm_translation: Rav Kahana said: What is the verse? "And the elders of his city shall call him," not the elders of her city.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַמֵּימָר: הִילְכְתָא, כּוֹפִין אוֹתוֹ וְיֵלֵךְ לִמְקוֹם הַוַּועַד. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אָשֵׁי לְאַמֵּימָר: וְהָא אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: כּוֹפִין אוֹתוֹ וְדָן בְּעִירוֹ! הָנֵי מִילֵּי הֵיכָא דְּקָאָמַר לֵיהּ לֹוֶה לְמַלְוֶה, אֲבָל מַלְוֶה – ״עֶבֶד לֹוֶה לְאִישׁ מַלְוֶה״.
human_translation: Ameimar says: halakha is compelled to go to the place of the Assembly. Rav Ashi said to Ameimar: But doesn’t Rabbi Elazar say he is compelled be judged in his city? This statement where the borrower said to the lender: But lender “The borrower is servant to the lender”
llm_translation: Amemar said: The halakha is that we force him and he goes to the place of the assembly. Rav Ashe said to Amemar: But didn't Rabbi Elazar say: We force him and judge him in his city! These matters are where he is saying to him, "Lend to a borrower," but if one is borrowing, "A borrower is a slave to the lender."

hebrew_text: שְׁלַחוּ לֵיהּ לְמָר עוּקְבָא: לִדְזִיו לֵיהּ כְּבַר בִּתְיָה, שְׁלָם. עוּקְבָן הַבַּבְלִי קְבַל קֳדָמַנָא: יִרְמְיָה אָחִי הֶעֱבִיר עָלַי אֶת הַדֶּרֶךְ. אִמְרוּ לוֹ: הַשִּׂיאוּהוּ וְיִרְאֶה פָּנֵינוּ בִּטְבֶרְיָא.
human_translation: sent to Mar Ukva, To he who has light like the son of Bithiah, Shalom. Ukvan the Babylonian complained before us Yirmeya, my brother, came past me, And tell induce him [ hassiuhu ] to see our face in Tiberias,
llm_translation: Send to him to Mar Ukva: "To decorate for him a barrel of wine, pay." Ukvan the Babylonian received before us: "Jeremiah my brother passed over the road." They said to him: "Bring him and let him see our faces in Tiberias."

hebrew_text: הָא גוּפָא קַשְׁיָא: אָמְרַתְּ ״אִמְרוּ לוֹ״, אַלְמָא דַּיְּינוּהּ אַתּוּן. ״הַשִּׂיאוּהוּ וְיִרְאֶה פָּנֵינוּ בִּטְבֶרְיָא״, אַלְמָא שַׁדְּרוּהּ הָכָא.
human_translation: This itself difficult You said: Tell him. Apparently Judge him yourselves Induce him to see our face in Tiberias. Apparently Send him here.
llm_translation: The matter is difficult: you said "tell him," implying that you are bringing it. "Bring him and let him see our faces in Tiberias," implying that you send him here.

hebrew_text: (אֶלָּא), הָכִי קָאָמְרִי: אֱמַרוּ לֵיהּ, דַּיְּינוּהּ אַתּוּן. אִי צָיֵית – צָיֵית, וְאִי לָא – הַשִּׂיאוּהוּ וְיִרְאֶה פָּנֵינוּ בִּטְבֶרְיָא.
human_translation: Rather, this were saying: Tell him, judge yourselves. If he listens he listens, But if not induce him to see our face in Tiberias.
llm_translation: Rather, this is what they are saying: They told him, "You have judged it." If you have seen - you have seen, and if not - bring him and we will see his face in Tiberias.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: דִּינֵי קְנָסוֹת הֲוָה, וּבְבָבֶל לָא דָּיְינִי דִּינֵי קְנָסוֹת. וְהָא דִּשְׁלַחוּ לֵיהּ הָכִי – כְּדֵי לַחֲלוֹק כָּבוֹד לְמָר עוּקְבָא.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: it was the halakhot of fines, and in Babylonia do not adjudicate the halakhot of fines, And that they sent this in order to give honor to Mar Ukva,
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: The laws of penalties were applicable, but in Babylonia, the laws of penalties were not applicable. And that which they sent to him was thus - in order to bestow honor upon Master Ukva.

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ זֶה בּוֹרֵר.
llm_translation: We will return to you, Zeh Borer.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אֶחָד דִּינֵי מָמוֹנוֹת וְאֶחָד דִּינֵי נְפָשׁוֹת בִּדְרִישָׁה וּבַחֲקִירָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״מִשְׁפַּט אֶחָד יִהְיֶה לָכֶם״.
human_translation: Both monetary law and capital law are equal with regard to inquiry and interrogation as it is stated: “You shall have one manner of law”
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One court for monetary cases and one court for capital cases, through inquiry and investigation, as it is stated: "One law shall be for you."

hebrew_text: מָה בֵּין דִּינֵי מָמוֹנוֹת לְדִינֵי נְפָשׁוֹת? דִּינֵי מָמוֹנוֹת – בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה, וְדִינֵי נְפָשׁוֹת – בְּעֶשְׂרִים וּשְׁלֹשָׁה. דִּינֵי מָמוֹנוֹת – פּוֹתְחִין בֵּין לִזְכוּת בֵּין לְחוֹבָה, וְדִינֵי נְפָשׁוֹת – פּוֹתְחִין לִזְכוּת וְאֵין פּוֹתְחִין לְחוֹבָה.
human_translation: What between monetary law and capital law? monetary law by three and capital law by twenty-three monetary law, opens either to exempt or to find liable. And capital law, opens to acquit but does not open to find liable.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: What is the difference between civil cases involving monetary matters and civil cases involving capital offenses? Civil cases involving monetary matters - are tried by three judges, and civil cases involving capital offenses - by twenty-three. Civil cases involving monetary matters - the court may open the case for acquittal or for liability, and civil cases involving capital offenses - the court may open the case for acquittal but may not open it for liability.

hebrew_text: דִּינֵי מָמוֹנוֹת – מַטִּין עַל פִּי אֶחָד, בֵּין לִזְכוּת בֵּין לְחוֹבָה, וְדִינֵי נְפָשׁוֹת – מַטִּין עַל פִּי אֶחָד לִזְכוּת, וְעַל פִּי שְׁנַיִם לְחוֹבָה.
human_translation: monetary law, directs, based on one either to exempt, or to find liable. But capital law, directs based on one to acquit and based on two to find liable.
llm_translation: Laws of monetary matters - we judge based on one witness, whether for merit or for liability. And laws of capital offenses - we judge based on one witness for merit, and based on two witnesses for liability.

hebrew_text: דִּינֵי מָמוֹנוֹת – מַחְזִירִין בֵּין לִזְכוּת בֵּין לְחוֹבָה, דִּינֵי נְפָשׁוֹת – מַחְזִירִין לִזְכוּת וְאֵין מַחְזִירִין לְחוֹבָה.
human_translation: monetary law, brings back either to exempt or to find liable. capital law, brings back to acquit but does not bring to find liable.
llm_translation: Laws of monetary matters - we return whether to merit or to obligation, laws of life - we return to merit and we do not return to obligation.

hebrew_text: דִּינֵי מָמוֹנוֹת – הַכֹּל מְלַמְּדִין זְכוּת וְחוֹבָה, דִּינֵי נְפָשׁוֹת – הַכֹּל מְלַמְּדִין זְכוּת, וְאֵין הַכֹּל מְלַמְּדִין חוֹבָה.
human_translation: monetary law, all may teach exempt or liable. capital law, all may teach acquit but not all may teach liable.
llm_translation: Laws of monetary matters - everything teaches merit and obligation, laws of life - everything teaches merit, and not everything teaches obligation.

hebrew_text: דִּינֵי מָמוֹנוֹת – הַמְלַמֵּד חוֹבָה מְלַמֵּד זְכוּת, וְהַמְלַמֵּד זְכוּת מְלַמֵּד חוֹבָה. דִּינֵי נְפָשׁוֹת – הַמְלַמֵּד חוֹבָה מְלַמֵּד זְכוּת, אֲבָל הַמְלַמֵּד זְכוּת אֵין יָכוֹל לַחְזוֹר וּלְלַמֵּד חוֹבָה.
human_translation: monetary law, one who teaches liable may teach exempt and one who teaches exempt may teach liable. capital law, one who teaches liable may teach acquit, but one who teaches acquit may not return and teach liable.
llm_translation: Laws of monetary matters - one who teaches obligation teaches merit, and one who teaches merit teaches obligation. Laws of life - one who teaches obligation teaches merit, but one who teaches merit cannot go back and teach obligation.

hebrew_text: דִּינֵי מָמוֹנוֹת – דָּנִין בַּיּוֹם, וְגוֹמְרִין בַּלַּיְלָה. דִּינֵי נְפָשׁוֹת – דָּנִין בַּיּוֹם, וְגוֹמְרִין בַּיּוֹם.
human_translation: monetary law, judges during the daytime, and may conclude at night. capital law, judges during the daytime, and concludes in the daytime.
llm_translation: Laws of monetary matters - adjudicate during the day, and conclude at night. Laws of life - adjudicate during the day, and conclude during the day.

hebrew_text: דִּינֵי מָמוֹנוֹת – גּוֹמְרִין בּוֹ בַּיּוֹם, בֵּין לִזְכוּת בֵּין לְחוֹבָה. דִּינֵי נְפָשׁוֹת – גּוֹמְרִין בּוֹ בַּיּוֹם לִזְכוּת, וּבַיּוֹם שֶׁלְּאַחֲרָיו לְחוֹבָה. לְפִיכָךְ, אֵין דָּנִין לֹא בְּעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת וְלֹא בְּעֶרֶב יוֹם טוֹב.
human_translation: monetary law, conclude on that same day, whether to exempt or to find liable. capital law, conclude on that same day to acquit the following day to liable. Therefore, does not judge neither on the eve of Shabbat nor the eve of a Festival.
llm_translation: Laws of monetary matters - we conclude in it during the day, whether for merit or for obligation. Laws of capital offenses - we conclude in it during the day for merit, and on the following day for obligation. Therefore, we do not adjudicate neither on Friday evening nor on the eve of a festival.

hebrew_text: דִּינֵי מָמוֹנוֹת, הַטְּמָאוֹת וְהַטְּהָרוֹת – מַתְחִילִין מִן הַגָּדוֹל. דִּינֵי נְפָשׁוֹת – מַתְחִילִין מִן הַצַּד.
human_translation: monetary law, the ritual impurity and purity, commence from the greatest capital law, commence from the side,
llm_translation: Laws of monetary matters, impure and pure - we begin with the elder. Laws of life - we begin from the side.

hebrew_text: הַכֹּל כְּשֵׁרִין לָדוּן דִּינֵי מָמוֹנוֹת, וְאֵין הַכֹּל כְּשֵׁרִין לָדוּן דִּינֵי נְפָשׁוֹת, אֶלָּא כֹּהֲנִים לְוִיִּם וְיִשְׂרְאֵלִים הַמַּשִּׂיאִין לַכְּהוּנָּה.
human_translation: All are fit to judge monetary law. But not all are fit to judge capital law; only priests, Levites, and Israelites who marry to the priesthood
llm_translation: All are fit to judge monetary cases, but not all are fit to judge capital cases, only Kohanim, Levi'im, and Yisraelim who are appointed to the priesthood.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ דִּינֵי מָמוֹנוֹת מִי בָּעֵינַן דְּרִישָׁה וַחֲקִירָה? וּרְמִינְהוּ: שְׁטָר שֶׁזְּמַנּוֹ כָּתוּב בְּאֶחָד בְּנִיסָן בַּשְּׁמִיטָּה, וּבָאוּ עֵדִים וְאָמְרוּ: ״הֵיאַךְ אַתֶּם מְעִידִין עַל שְׁטָר זֶה? וַהֲלֹא בְּיוֹם פְּלוֹנִי עִמָּנוּ הֱיִיתֶם בְּמָקוֹם פְּלוֹנִי!״ שְׁטָר כָּשֵׁר וְעֵדָיו כְּשֵׁרִין. חָיְישִׁינַן שֶׁמָּא אִיחֲרוּהוּ וּכְתָבוּהוּ.
human_translation: Do we require inquiry and interrogation monetary law? And raises a contradiction note whose date is written on the first of Nisan of the Sabbatical and witnesses came and said How you are testifying concerning this note? But not on such and such day you were with us in such and such place? note valid, and its witnesses fit we are concerned perhaps they delayed and wrote it,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Regarding monetary laws, do we require investigation and inquiry? And it was raised: A document that was dated on the first of Nisan during the Sabbatical year, and witnesses came and said, "How can you testify about this document? Were you not with us on such and such a day in such and such a place?" The document is valid, and its witnesses are valid. We are concerned that perhaps they delayed writing it. English translation:

hebrew_text: וְאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ בָּעֵינַן דְּרִישָׁה וַחֲקִירָה, הֵיכִי חָיְישִׁינַן שֶׁמָּא אִיחֲרוּהוּ וּכְתָבוּהוּ?
human_translation: And if it enters your mind we require inquiry and interrogation how are we concerned perhaps they delayed and wrote it?
llm_translation: And if it comes to your mind that we require investigation and inquiry, how do we concern ourselves lest they delayed it and wrote it?

hebrew_text: וְלִיטַעְמָיךְ, תִּיקְשֵׁי לָךְ מַתְנִיתִין: שִׁטְרֵי חוֹב הַמּוּקְדָּמִין פְּסוּלִים, וְהַמְאוּחָרִים כְּשֵׁרִין. וְאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ בָּעֵינַן דְּרִישָׁה וַחֲקִירָה, מְאוּחָרִין אַמַּאי כְּשֵׁרִין?
human_translation: And according to your reasoning the mishna should pose a difficulty for you Antedated promissory notes not valid, but postdated valid. And if it enters your mind we require inquiry and interrogation why postdated valid?
llm_translation: And to taste, you should analyze the Mishnah: promissory notes of debts that are advanced are invalid, and those that are delayed are valid. And if it enters your mind that we require investigation and inquiry, why are the delayed ones valid?

hebrew_text: הָא לָא קַשְׁיָא, דַּעֲדִיפָא מִינַּהּ קָאָמְרִינַן. דַּאֲפִילּוּ אֶחָד בְּנִיסָן בִּשְׁמִיטָּה, דְּלָא שְׁכִיחִי אִינָשֵׁי דְּמוֹזְפִי, דְּלֵיכָּא לְמֵימַר שֶׁמָּא אִיחֲרוּהוּ וּכְתָבוּהוּ דְּלָא מַרַע לִשְׁטָרֵיהּ, אֲפִילּוּ הָכִי, כֵּיוָן דִּשְׁבִיעִית סוֹפָהּ מְשַׁמֶּטֶת – מַכְשְׁרִינַן.
human_translation: This not difficult. We are saying a better, than that even first of Nisan when not common people to lend where is not to say perhaps they delayed and wrote as one would not damage his note even so, since Sabbatical cancels its close, we deem valid.
llm_translation: Here is the English word-for-word translation of the Talmudic text: "This is not difficult, for we say that it is preferable. For even if one deals with it in Nisan during the Sabbatical year, when people are not commonly found to be fraudulent, so that it cannot be said that perhaps they delayed it and wrote it, which would not be harmful to their documents, even so, since the seventh year ultimately nullifies it, it is valid."

hebrew_text: מִכׇּל מָקוֹם, קַשְׁיָא. סִימָן: חרפ״ש.
human_translation: In any case, difficult. a mnemonic Ḥet , reish , peh , shin .
llm_translation: From all places, Kashya. Symbol: Cherpesh.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: דְּבַר תּוֹרָה, אֶחָד דִּינֵי מָמוֹנוֹת וְאֶחָד דִּינֵי נְפָשׁוֹת בִּדְרִישָׁה וּבַחֲקִירָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״מִשְׁפַּט אֶחָד יִהְיֶה לָכֶם״. וּמָה טַעַם אָמְרוּ דִּינֵי מָמוֹנוֹת לָא בָּעֵינַן דְּרִישָׁה וַחֲקִירָה? כְּדֵי שֶׁלֹּא תִּנְעוֹל דֶּלֶת בִּפְנֵי לֹוִין.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina says: By Torah law, both monetary law and capital law with regard to inquiry and interrogation as it is stated: “You shall have one manner of law” And what is the reason said monetary law we do not need inquiry and interrogation? so as not to lock the door in the face of borrowers.
llm_translation: Rabbi Chanina said: A matter of Torah, whether it involves monetary matters or matters of life, requires investigation and inquiry, as it is stated: "One law shall be for you." And why did they say that monetary matters do not require investigation and inquiry? So that the door will not be closed in the face of borrowers.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה
human_translation: If that is so
llm_translation: Rather, from now on.

hebrew_text: טָעוּ – לֹא יְשַׁלְּמוּ? כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן שֶׁתִּנְעוֹל דֶּלֶת בִּפְנֵי לוֹוִין!
human_translation: erred they should not pay all the more so that would lock the door in the face of borrowers.
llm_translation: They erred - shall they not pay? All the more so that one should lock the door before thieves!

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: מַתְנִיתִין דְּהָכָא בְּדִינֵי קְנָסוֹת, וְאִידַּךְ בְּהוֹדָאוֹת וְהַלְוָאוֹת.
human_translation: Rava says: the mishna here, with regard to laws of fines, And the other with regard to admissions and loans,
llm_translation: Rava said: Mishnaic teachings here regarding monetary penalties, and the other Mishnaic teachings regarding admissions and loans.

hebrew_text: רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר: אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי בְּהוֹדָאָה וְהַלְוָאָה. כָּאן – בְּדִין מְרוּמֶּה, כָּאן – בְּדִין שֶׁאֵינוֹ מְרוּמֶּה.
human_translation: Rav Pappa says: This and that, with regard to an admission and a loan. here, with regard to fraudulent trial, There, with regard to a trial that not fraudulent.
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: Both this and that are with acknowledgment and loan. Here - in a case of elevated judgment, here - in a case of non-elevated judgment.

hebrew_text: כִּדְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ, דְּרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ רָמֵי: כְּתִיב ״בְּצֶדֶק תִּשְׁפֹּט עֲמִיתֶךָ״, וּכְתִיב ״צֶדֶק צֶדֶק תִּרְדֹּף״. הָא כֵּיצַד? כָּאן – בְּדִין מְרוּמֶּה, כָּאן – בְּדִין שֶׁאֵין מְרוּמֶּה.
human_translation: in accordance with of Reish Lakish, as Reish Lakish raises a contradiction is written “In justice shall you judge your neighbor” and is written “Justice, justice, shall you follow” How these Here, with regard to fraudulent trial, there, with regard to a trial that not fraudulent.
llm_translation: As Reish Lakish expounded, Reish Lakish raised a contradiction: It is written, "In righteousness you shall judge your fellow," and it is written, "Justice, justice you shall pursue." How so? Here - in a lofty court case, here - in a case that is not lofty.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: מַתְנִיתִין כִּדְשַׁנִּין, קְרָאֵי אֶחָד לְדִין וְאֶחָד לִפְשָׁרָה.
human_translation: Rav Ashi says: the mishna here, as we answered, verses one with regard to judgment, and one with regard to compromise.
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: Mishnayot are like almonds, one verse for judgment and one verse for explanation.

hebrew_text: כִּדְתַנְיָא: ״צֶדֶק צֶדֶק תִּרְדֹּף״ – אֶחָד לְדִין וְאֶחָד לִפְשָׁרָה. כֵּיצַד? שְׁתֵּי סְפִינוֹת עוֹבְרוֹת בַּנָּהָר וּפָגְעוּ זֶה בָּזֶה, אִם עוֹבְרוֹת שְׁתֵּיהֶן – שְׁתֵּיהֶן טוֹבְעוֹת, בְּזֶה אַחַר זֶה – שְׁתֵּיהֶן עוֹבְרוֹת. וְכֵן שְׁנֵי גְּמַלִּים שֶׁהָיוּ עוֹלִים בְּמַעֲלוֹת בֵּית חוֹרוֹן וּפָגְעוּ זֶה בָּזֶה, אִם עָלוּ שְׁנֵיהֶן – שְׁנֵיהֶן נוֹפְלִין, בְּזֶה אַחַר זֶה – שְׁנֵיהֶן עוֹלִין.
human_translation: As it is taught “Justice, justice, shall you follow,” one with regard to judgment and one with regard to compromise. How so? two boats traveling on the river and they encounter each other, if both of them pass, both of them sink, one after the other, both of them pass. And similarly, two camels who were ascending the ascent of Beit Ḥoron, and they encounter each other, if both of them ascend, both of them fall. one after the other, both of them ascend.
llm_translation: As it was taught: "Justice, justice you shall pursue" - one for judgment and one for compromise. How so? Two ships are passing in the river and they collide with each other, if both pass - both sink, if one after the other - both pass. And similarly, two camels that were ascending the steps of Beit Horon and they collided with each other, if both ascend - both fall, if one after the other - both ascend.

hebrew_text: הָא כֵּיצַד? טְעוּנָה וְשֶׁאֵינָהּ טְעוּנָה – תִּידָּחֶה שֶׁאֵינָהּ טְעוּנָה מִפְּנֵי טְעוּנָה. קְרוֹבָה וְשֶׁאֵינָהּ קְרוֹבָה – תִּידָּחֶה קְרוֹבָה מִפְּנֵי שֶׁאֵינָהּ קְרוֹבָה. הָיוּ שְׁתֵּיהֶן קְרוֹבוֹת, שְׁתֵּיהֶן רְחוֹקוֹת – הָטֵל פְּשָׁרָה בֵּינֵיהֶן, וּמֵעֲלוֹת שָׂכָר זוֹ לָזוֹ.
human_translation: How laden and that is not laden, that is not laden should be overridden due to that is laden. close and that is not close close should be overridden due to that is not close. both of them were close both of them were far impose a compromise between them and pay a fee to one other,
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "How so? If it is necessary and it is not necessary - the unnecessary one is rejected because of the necessary one. If it is close and it is not close - the close one is rejected because it is not close. If both are close, both are far - cast a compromise between them, and the reward of this one to that one."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״צֶדֶק צֶדֶק תִּרְדֹּף״ – הַלֵּךְ אַחַר בֵּית דִּין יָפֶה, אַחַר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר לְלוֹד, אַחַר רַבָּן יוֹחָנָן בֶּן זַכַּאי לִבְרוּר חַיִל.
human_translation: The Sages taught: “Justice, justice, shall you follow.” follow the best, court after Rabbi Eliezer to Lod, after Rabban Yoḥanan ben Zakkai to Beror Ḥayil.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: "Justice, justice you shall pursue" - follow a fair court, after Rabbi Eliezer the Modai, after Rabban Yochanan ben Zakkai to clarify the matter.

hebrew_text: תָּנָא: קוֹל רֵיחַיִם בְּבוּרְנִי – שְׁבוּעַ הַבֵּן, שְׁבוּעַ הַבֵּן. אוֹר הַנֵּר בִּבְרוּר חַיִל – מִשְׁתֶּה שָׁם, מִשְׁתֶּה שָׁם.
human_translation: taught: the sound of a millstone in Burni, Week of the son, week of the son, light of a lamp in Beror Ḥayil, feast there, feast there.
llm_translation: It was taught: "The voice of Rechayim in Burni - a week for the son, a week for the son. The light of the lamp in clarified oil - a feast there, a feast there."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״צֶדֶק צֶדֶק תִּרְדֹּף״ – הַלֵּךְ אַחַר חֲכָמִים לִישִׁיבָה. אַחַר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר לְלוֹד, אַחַר רַבָּן יוֹחָנָן בֶּן זַכַּאי לִבְרוּר חַיִל, אַחַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ לִפְקִיעִין, אַחַר רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל לְיַבְנֶה, אַחַר רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא לִבְנֵי בְרָק, אַחַר רַבִּי מַתְיָא לְרוֹמִי, אַחַר רַבִּי חֲנַנְיָה בֶּן תְּרַדְיוֹן לְסִיכְנִי, אַחַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי לְצִיפּוֹרִי, אַחַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בְּתִירָה לִנְצִיבִין, אַחַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ לַגּוֹלָה, אַחַר רַבִּי לְבֵית שְׁעָרִים, אַחַר חֲכָמִים לְלִשְׁכַּת הַגָּזִית.
human_translation: The Sages taught: “Justice, justice, shall you follow.” follow the Sages to the academy after Rabbi Eliezer to Lod, after Rabban Yoḥanan ben Zakkai to Beror Ḥayil, after Rabbi Yehoshua to Peki’in, after Rabban Gamliel to Yavne, after Rabbi Akiva to Bnei Brak, after Rabbi Matya to Rome [ Romi ], after Rabbi Ḥananya ben Teradyon to Sikhnei, after Rabbi Yosei to Tzippori, after Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira to Netzivin, after Rabbi Yehoshua to the exile [ gola ], after Rabbi to Beit She’arim, after the Sages to the Chamber of Hewn Stone.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: "Justice, justice you shall pursue" - follow after the sages to the study hall. After Rabbi Eliezer to Lod, after Rabban Yochanan ben Zakkai to Beroor Chayil, after Rabbi Yehoshua to Peki'in, after Rabban Gamliel to Yavneh, after Rabbi Akiva to Bnei Brak, after Rabbi Matya to Rome, after Rabbi Chananya ben Teradyon to Sikhnin, after Rabbi Yosei to Tzipori, after Rabbi Yehuda ben Betera to Nitzivin, after Rabbi Yehoshua to exile, after Rabbi to Beit She'arim, after the sages to the Chamber of Hewn Stone.

hebrew_text: דִּינֵי מָמוֹנוֹת פּוֹתְחִין כּוּ׳. הֵיכִי אָמְרִינַן? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: הָכִי אָמְרִינַן לְהוּ: מִי יֵימַר כִּדְקָאָמְרִיתוּ?
human_translation: monetary law, opens How do we say Rav Yehuda said: We say this to Who says as you said?
llm_translation: Monetary laws are opened. How do we say? Rav Yehudah said: Thus we say to him: Who will say as you have said?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ עוּלָּא: וְהָא חָסְמִינַן לְהוּ? וְלִיחַסְמוּ! מִי לָא תַּנְיָא: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר, מַסִּיעִין אֶת הָעֵדִים מִמָּקוֹם לְמָקוֹם כְּדֵי שֶׁתִּיטָּרֵף דַּעְתָּן וְיַחְזְרוּ בָּהֶן?
human_translation: Ulla said to him: But we silence them. And let them be silenced. Isn’t it taught Rabbi Shimon ben Eliezer says: brings the witnesses from place to place in order to confuse them so that they will retract
llm_translation: He said to him Ulah: And should we suspect them? Let them be suspected! Who did not teach: Rabbi Shimon ben Eliezer says, we accompany the witnesses from place to place so that their minds will be confused and they will retract.

hebrew_text: מִי דָּמֵי? הָתָם מִמֵּילָא קָא מִידְּחוּ, הָכָא קָא דָחֵינַן לְהוּ בְּיָדַיִם.
human_translation: Are comparable? There, are repressed by themselves, here, we repress them by action,
llm_translation: Who is similar? There, from the word "mila" it is immediately pushed aside, here we push it aside with our hands.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר עוּלָּא: הָכִי אָמְרִינַן, ״יֵשׁ לְךָ עֵדִים לַהֲזִימָּם?״ אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבָּה: וְכִי פּוֹתְחִין בִּזְכוּתוֹ שֶׁל זֶה שֶׁהִיא חוֹבָתוֹ שֶׁל זֶה?
human_translation: Rather, Ulla says: We say this Do you have witnesses to determine conspiring witnesses? Rabba said to him: But do we open with acquit that is the liability of this
llm_translation: Rather, Ula said: Thus we say, "Do you have witnesses to incriminate them?" Rabba said to him: Do we begin with the merit of this one, which is the obligation of that one?

hebrew_text: וּמִי הָוְיָא חוֹבָתוֹ? וְהָתְנַן: אֵין עֵדִים זוֹמְמִין נֶהֱרָגִין עַד שֶׁיִּגָּמֵר הַדִּין.
human_translation: But is the liability of But didn’t we learn Conspiring witnesses are not killed until the verdict is issued?
llm_translation: And who was his creditor? And it was taught: Witnesses who are found to be conspiring are executed only after the judgment is completed.

hebrew_text: הָכִי אָמֵינָא: אִילּוּ שָׁתֵיק הַאי עַד דְּמִיגְמָר דִּינֵיהּ, וּמַיְיתִי עֵדִים וּמַזֵּים לְהוּ, הָוְיָא לֵיהּ חוֹבָתוֹ שֶׁל זֶה. אֶלָּא אָמַר רַבָּה: אָמְרִינַן לֵיהּ, ״יֵשׁ לְךָ עֵדִים לְהַכְחִישָׁן?״
human_translation: This I say: If would be silent until his verdict is issued and brings witnesses and determines them conspiring is the liability of this Rather, Rabba says: We say to Do you have witnesses to contradict them?
llm_translation: So I say: If this one remained silent until his judgment was completed, and then brought witnesses and refuted them, the obligation of this one would be upon him. Rather, Rabba said: We say to him, "Do you have witnesses to contradict them?"

hebrew_text: רַב כָּהֲנָא אָמַר: ״מִדִּבְרֵיכֶם נִזְדַּכָּה פְּלוֹנִי״. אַבָּיֵי וְרָבָא דְּאָמְרִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ: אָמְרִינַן לֵיהּ, ״אִי לָא קְטַלְתְּ לָא תִּדְחַל״. רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: ״כׇּל מִי שֶׁיּוֹדֵעַ לוֹ זְכוּת יָבֹא וִילַמֵּד עָלָיו״.
human_translation: Rav Kahana said: Based on your statements, so-and-so is acquitted. Abaye and Rava both say: We say to if you did not kill do not fear Rav Ashi says: Whoever knows to acquit should come and teach concerning him.
llm_translation: Rav Kahana said: "From your words we can infer so-and-so." Abbaye and Rava both said: We say to him, "If you did not kill, do not fear." Rav Ashi said: "Anyone who knows his merit should come and learn on him."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּוָותֵיהּ דְּאַבָּיֵי וְרָבָא. רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: ״אִם לֹא שָׁכַב אִישׁ אוֹתָךְ וְאִם לֹא שָׂטִית וְגוֹ׳״ –
human_translation: It is taught in accordance with of Abaye and Rava. Rabbi says: “If no man has lain with you and if you have not gone astray
llm_translation: It was taught in the school of Abaye and Rava. Rabbi says: "If a man has not lain with you, and if you have not strayed, etc." -

hebrew_text: מִיכָּן שֶׁפּוֹתְחִין בְּדִינֵי נְפָשׁוֹת תְּחִלָּה לִזְכוּת.
human_translation: From here in capital law, opens first to acquit
llm_translation: From here, one begins with cases of capital law in order to merit.

hebrew_text: דִּינֵי מָמוֹנוֹת מַחֲזִירִין כּוּ׳. וּרְמִינְהוּ: דָּן אֶת הַדִּין, זִיכָּה אֶת הַחַיָּיב, חִיֵּיב אֶת הַזַּכַּאי, טִימֵּא אֶת הַטָּהוֹר, טִיהֵר אֶת הַטָּמֵא – מַה שֶּׁעָשָׂה עָשׂוּי, וִישַׁלֵּם מִבֵּיתוֹ.
human_translation: monetary law, brings back And raises a contradiction issued a judgment exempts a liable finds an innocent liable, ruled a pure impure ruled an impure pure, what he did is done, and must pay from his home,
llm_translation: Laws of monetary matters are returned thus. And they raised a dilemma: He judges the case, acquits the liable, obligates the innocent, declares impure the pure, declares pure the impure - what he did is done, and he shall pay from his own property.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: לָא קַשְׁיָא, כָּאן בְּמוּמְחֶה, כָּאן בְּשֶׁאֵינוֹ מוּמְחֶה. וּבְמוּמְחֶה מַחְזִירִין? וְהָקָתָנֵי: אִם הָיָה מוּמְחֶה לְבֵית דִּין – פָּטוּר מִלְּשַׁלֵּם!
human_translation: Rav Yosef says: not difficult. here, with regard to an expert, there with regard to who was not an expert. And one bring back in an expert? But teaches: If he was an expert by court exempt from to pay.
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: Not difficult, here in b'mumcheh, here in she'eino mumcheh. And in b'mumcheh they return? But it is taught: If he was mumcheh to the court - he is exempt from paying!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: כָּאן שֶׁיֵּשׁ גָּדוֹל הֵימֶנּוּ בְּחָכְמָה וּבְמִנְיָן, כָּאן שֶׁאֵין גָּדוֹל הֵימֶנּוּ בְּחָכְמָה וּבְמִנְיָן.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman says here, where there is greater than in wisdom and number there, where there is no greater than his in wisdom and number
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said: Here, where there is one who is greater than him in wisdom and in number, here, where there is none greater than him in wisdom and in number.

hebrew_text: רַב שֵׁשֶׁת אָמַר: כָּאן שֶׁטָּעָה בִּדְבַר מִשְׁנָה, כָּאן שֶׁטָּעָה בְּשִׁיקּוּל הַדַּעַת. דְּאָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת אָמַר רַב אַסִּי: טָעָה בִּדְבַר מִשְׁנָה – חוֹזֵר, טָעָה בְּשִׁיקּוּל הַדַּעַת – אֵינוֹ חוֹזֵר.
human_translation: Rav Sheshet says here, where erred in a matter Mishna, there, where erred in deliberation. As Rav Sheshet says Rav Asi says: erred in a matter Mishna, revoked, erred in deliberation, not revoked.
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet said: Here, one erred in a matter of Mishnah, here, one erred in weighing the mind. As Rav Sheshet said in the name of Rav Assi: If one erred in a matter of Mishnah - he may retract, if one erred in weighing the mind - he may not retract.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבִינָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: אֲפִילּוּ טָעָה בְּרַבִּי חִיָּיא וְרַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִין. אֲפִילּוּ בִּדְרַב וּשְׁמוּאֵל? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִין. אֲפִילּוּ בְּדִידִי וְדִידָךְ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַטּוּ אֲנַן קָטְלֵי קְנֵי בְּאַגְמָא אֲנַן?
human_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: even erred concerning Rabbi Ḥiyya and Rabbi Oshaya, said to him: Yes. even concerning of Rav and Shmuel? said to him: Yes. even concerning of mine and yours, said to him: Is that to say we are reed cutters in the pond?
llm_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: Even if one made a mistake regarding Rabbi Chiya and Rabbi Oshaya? He said to him: No. Even in the case of Rav and Shmuel? He said to him: No. Even in my case and your case? He said to him: Are we then killing each other with reeds in the marsh?

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי דָּמֵי שִׁיקּוּל הַדַּעַת? אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: כְּגוֹן תְּרֵי תַּנָּאֵי אוֹ תְּרֵי אָמוֹרָאֵי דִּפְלִיגִי אַהֲדָדֵי, וְלָא אִיתְּמַר הִלְכְתָא לָא כְּמָר וְלָא כְּמָר, וְאִיקְּרִי וַעֲבַד כְּחַד מִינַּיְיהוּ, וְסוּגְיָא דִּשְׁמַעְתָּא אָזְלִי כְּאִידַּךְ – הַיְינוּ שִׁיקּוּל הַדַּעַת.
human_translation: What is considered a deliberation? Rav Pappa says: For example, two tanna’im or two amora’im who disagree with each other, and the halakha was not stated in accordance with Sage or in accordance with Sage, and it occurred acted in accordance with one of them, and the discussion of the halakha goes in accordance with the other this is a deliberation.
llm_translation: How is the weighing of the mind? Rav Papa said: For example, two Tannaim or two Amoraim who argue with each other, and the halacha is not established like this one or like that one, but rather they combine their opinions together, and the conclusion goes in a different direction - that is the weighing of the mind.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רַב הַמְנוּנָא לְרַב שֵׁשֶׁת: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּפָרָה שֶׁל בֵּית מְנַחֵם שֶׁנִּיטְּלָה הָאֵם שֶׁלָּהּ, וְהֶאֱכִילָהּ רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן לִכְלָבִים.
human_translation: Rav Hamnuna raised an objection to Rav Sheshet an incident involving a cow of the household of Menaḥem whose womb was removed, And Rabbi Tarfon, fed it to the dogs.
llm_translation: He raised an objection to him, Rav Hamnuna to Rav Sheshet: There was an incident with the cow of the household of Menachem, whose mother was taken, and Rabbi Tarfon fed her to the dogs.

hebrew_text: וּבָא מַעֲשֶׂה לִפְנֵי חֲכָמִים בְּיַבְנֶה, וְהִתִּירוּהָ. שֶׁאָמַר תּוֹדוֹס הָרוֹפֵא: אֵין פָּרָה וַחֲזִירָה יוֹצֵאת מֵאֲלֶכְּסַנְדְּרִיָּא שֶׁל מִצְרַיִם אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן חוֹתְכִין הָאֵם שֶׁלָּהּ, כְּדֵי שֶׁלֹּא תֵּלֵד. אָמַר רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן: הָלְכָה חֲמוֹרְךָ, טַרְפוֹן! אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: פָּטוּר אַתָּה, שֶׁכׇּל הַמּוּמְחֶה לָרַבִּים פָּטוּר מִלְּשַׁלֵּם.
human_translation: And the incident came before the Sages in Yavne, and they ruled permitted As Theodosius [ Todos ] the doctor said: A cow or pig does not emerge from Alexandria of Egypt unless sever its womb so that it will not give birth Rabbi Tarfon said: Your donkey is gone, Tarfon, Rabbi Akiva said to him: You are exempt, as any an expert for the public exempt from to pay.
llm_translation: And there was an incident that came before the sages in Yavneh, and they permitted it. For Todos the doctor said: A cow and a pig do not come out from the Alexandrian womb of Egypt unless one cuts off its mother's womb, so that she does not give birth. Rabbi Tarfon said: Your law is a donkey, Tarfon! Rabbi Akiva said to him: You are exempt, for anyone who prevents damage to the public is exempt from paying.

hebrew_text: וְאִי אִיתָא, לֵימָא לֵיהּ: טוֹעֶה בִּדְבַר מִשְׁנָה אַתָּה, וְטוֹעֶה בִּדְבַר מִשְׁנָה חוֹזֵר.
human_translation: And if it is so let say to You err in a matter Mishna, and errs in a matter Mishna, revoked.
llm_translation: If it is stated, say to him: "You are mistaken in a matter of Mishnah, and you are mistaken in a matter of Mishnah returns."

hebrew_text: חֲדָא וְעוֹד קָאָמַר: חֲדָא, דְּטוֹעֶה בִּדְבַר מִשְׁנָה אַתָּה, וְטוֹעֶה בִּדְבַר מִשְׁנָה חוֹזֵר. וְעוֹד: אִי נָמֵי בְּשִׁיקּוּל הַדַּעַת טָעִיתָ – מוּמְחֶה לָרַבִּים אַתָּה, וְכׇל הַמּוּמְחֶה לָרַבִּים פָּטוּר מִלְּשַׁלֵּם.
human_translation: states one and another One: As you err in a matter Mishna, and errs in a matter Mishna, revoked. Another: Even if you erred in a deliberation, you are an expert for the public, and any an expert for the public exempt from to pay.
llm_translation: One and furthermore he said: One, that you err in a matter of Mishnah, you, and you err in a matter of Mishnah, return. And furthermore: If indeed in the balance of knowledge you erred - you are a cause of stumbling to the many, and anyone who is a cause of stumbling to the many is exempt from paying.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק לְרָבָא: מַאי קָא מוֹתֵיב רַב הַמְנוּנָא לְרַב שֵׁשֶׁת מִפָּרָה? פָּרָה הֲרֵי הֶאֱכִילָהּ לִכְלָבִים, וְלֵיתָא דְּתֶהְדַּר.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said to Rava: What objection raised by Rav Hamnuna to Rav Sheshet from cow? fed cow to the dogs, and it is not to revoke
llm_translation: Rav Nachman son of Yitzchak said to Rava: What is Rav Hamnuna arguing with Rav Sheshet from the case of a cow? A cow, behold, it is fed to the dogs, and there is no adornment.

hebrew_text: הָכִי קָאָמַר לֵיהּ: אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא טָעָה בִּדְבַר מִשְׁנָה אֵינוֹ חוֹזֵר, אַלְמָא קָם דִּינָא – הַיְינוּ דְּקָא מְפַחֵיד רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן, וְקָאָמַר לֵיהּ אִיהוּ: מוּמְחֶה לְבֵית דִּין אַתָּה וְאַתָּה פָּטוּר מִלְּשַׁלֵּם. אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ טָעָה בִּדְבַר מִשְׁנָה חוֹזֵר, לֵימָא לֵיהּ: כֵּיוָן דְּאִילּוּ הֲוַאי פָּרָה, דִּינָךְ לָאו דִּינָא וְלָא כְּלוּם עֲבַדְתְּ, הַשְׁתָּא נָמֵי לָא כְּלוּם עֲבַדְתְּ.
human_translation: This was saying to Granted, if you say errs in a matter Mishna, not revoked, evidently the verdict stands that is Rabbi Tarfon feared and said to him: You are an expert by court, and exempt from to pay. But if you say erred in a matter Mishna, revoked, let say to Since if the cow were to be your verdict not a verdict and you did nothing, now as well, you did nothing
llm_translation: So he said to him: If you say that if one made a mistake in a matter of Mishnah, he does not retract, this implies that the judgment stands. That is why Rabbi Tarfon was upset, and he said to him: You are a blemished one before the court, and you are exempt from paying. But if you say that if one made a mistake in a matter of Mishnah, he does retract, say to him: Since if this were a cow, your judgment is not a judgment and you have done nothing, now also you have done nothing.

hebrew_text: רַב חִסְדָּא אָמַר: כָּאן – שֶׁנָּטַל וְנָתַן בַּיָּד, כָּאן – שֶׁלֹּא נָטַל וְנָתַן בַּיָּד.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda says there where took and gave with hand. here where did not take and give with hand.
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: Here - that he took and gave in hand, here - that he did not take and give in hand.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא חִיֵּיב אֶת הַזַּכַּאי, כְּגוֹן שֶׁנָּטַל וְנָתַן בַּיָּד. אֶלָּא זִיכָּה אֶת הַחַיָּיב, הֵיכִי מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ? דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ: ״פָּטוּר אַתָּה״, וְהָא לֹא נָטַל וְנָתַן בַּיָּד! כֵּיוָן דְּאָמַר ״פָּטוּר אַתָּה״, כְּמוֹ שֶׁנָּטַל וְנָתַן בַּיָּד דָּמֵי.
human_translation: Granted, finds an innocent liable, where took and gave with hand. But how can you find He exempts a liable As, said to You are exempt but did not take and give with hand. Once he says: You are exempt considered as if he took and gave with hand,
llm_translation: In truth, he obligates the innocent, such as when he took and gave into the hand. Rather, he acquits the guilty, how does he forget her? For he said to him: "You are exempt," and yet he did not take and give into the hand! Since he said, "You are exempt," it is as if he took and gave into the hand, the equivalent.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מַתְנִיתִין דְּקָתָנֵי: דִּינֵי מָמוֹנוֹת מַחְזִירִין בֵּין לִזְכוּת בֵּין לְחוֹבָה, בִּשְׁלָמָא לִזְכוּת מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ, דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ מֵעִיקָּרָא: ״חַיָּיב אַתָּה״, וְלֹא נָטַל וְלֹא נָתַן בַּיָּד. אֶלָּא לְחוֹבָה הֵיכִי מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ? דְּאָמַר לֵיהּ: ״פָּטוּר אַתָּה״? וְהָאָמְרַתְּ: כֵּיוָן דְּאָמַר לֵיהּ ״פָּטוּר אַתָּה״, כְּמוֹ שֶׁנָּטַל וְנָתַן בַּיָּד דָּמֵי!
human_translation: But the mishna, which teaches: monetary law, brings back either to exempt or to find liable? Granted, you find To exempt, where says at the outset You are liable and did not take and give with hand, But how can you find to find liable? As says to You are exempt, But you said once says: You are exempt considered as if he took and gave with hand.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rather, it is taught in a Mishnah: In cases of monetary matters, one may return the item whether it is for acquittal or for obligation. Granted, for acquittal, she forgets it, for he said to her initially: "You are obligated," and did not take the item and did not give it into her hand. But how does she forget it for obligation? For he said to her: "You are exempt"? But didn't you say: Since he said to her "You are exempt," it is as if he took the item and gave it into her hand, and it is considered as if the item is in her possession!

hebrew_text: חֲדָא קָתָנֵי: דִּינֵי מָמוֹנוֹת מַחְזִירִין לִזְכוּת, שֶׁהִיא חוֹבָה. דִּכְוָותַהּ גַּבֵּי נְפָשׁוֹת: מַחְזִירִין לִזְכוּת,
human_translation: teaches one monetary law, brings back to exempt which is liability in the corresponding with regard to capital brings back to acquit
llm_translation: One teaching: Laws of monetary matters we return for merit, as it is an obligation. As for matters of life: we return for merit.

hebrew_text: וְאֵין מַחְזִירִין לְחוֹבָה. מַחְזִירִין לִזְכוּת – זְכוּת גְּרֵידְתָּא, וְאֵין מַחְזִירִין לְחוֹבָה – לִזְכוּת שֶׁהִיא חוֹבָה.
human_translation: but do not bring back to find liable. brings back to acquit an acquittal alone But do not bring back to find liable, an acquittal that is a liability.
llm_translation: And we do not return for an obligation. We return for merit - the merit of a blade. And we do not return for an obligation - for a merit that is an obligation.

hebrew_text: חוֹבְתֵיהּ דְּמַאן? הָא לָא קַשְׁיָא, חוֹבְתֵיהּ דְּגוֹאֵל הַדָּם. מִשּׁוּם חוֹבְתֵיהּ דְּגוֹאֵל הַדָּם קָטְלִינַן לֵיהּ לְהַאי? וְעוֹד, מַאי ״בֵּין״ ״בֵּין״? קַשְׁיָא.
human_translation: A liability for whom? This not difficult, the liability, of the blood redeemer, due to the liability of the blood redeemer, we kill this one And further, what Whether whether difficult.
llm_translation: Its obligation whose? This not difficult, its obligation of redeemer the blood. Because its obligation of redeemer the blood we kill it for this? And furthermore, what "between" "between"? Difficult.

hebrew_text: רָבִינָא אָמַר: כְּגוֹן שֶׁהָיָה לוֹ בְּיָדוֹ מַשְׁכּוֹן, וּנְטָלוֹ מִמֶּנּוּ.
human_translation: Ravina said: where had in his possession collateral and took from him,
llm_translation: Ravinah said: For example, if he had a collateral in his possession, and it was taken from him.

hebrew_text: טִימֵּא אֶת הַטָּהוֹר, דְּאַגַּע בֵּיהּ שֶׁרֶץ. טִיהֵר אֶת הַטָּמֵא, שֶׁעֵירְבָן בֵּין פֵּירוֹתָיו.
human_translation: ruled a pure impure, where had touch a creeping animal ruled an impure pure, where mixed with produce,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Timmei et ha-tahor, de-agah bei shereitz. Tiheir et ha-tamei, she-eirvan bein peirotav. English translation: He defiles the pure, for he touched a creeping thing. He purifies the impure, for he mixed among his fruits.

hebrew_text: דִּינֵי נְפָשׁוֹת כּוּ׳. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מִנַּיִין לְיוֹצֵא מִבֵּית דִּין חַיָּיב, וְאָמַר אֶחָד ״יֵשׁ לִי לְלַמֵּד עָלָיו זְכוּת״, מִנַּיִין שֶׁמַּחְזִירִין אוֹתוֹ? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״נָקִי אַל תַּהֲרֹג״.
human_translation: capital law, the Sages taught: From where that leaving the court liable, and someone said: I have to teach acquit him, from where that brings back The verse states: The innocent you shall not slay,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Laws of capital cases. The Rabbis taught: From where do we know that one who is acquitted by the court is liable, and one says, "I have a merit to teach in his favor," from where do we know that they return him? The verse teaches, "Do not kill the innocent."

hebrew_text: וּמִנַּיִין לְיוֹצֵא מִבֵּית דִּין זַכַּאי, וְאָמַר אֶחָד: ״יֵשׁ לִי לְלַמֵּד עָלָיו חוֹבָה״, מִנַּיִין שֶׁאֵין מַחְזִירִין אוֹתוֹ? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״צַדִּיק אַל תַּהֲרֹג״.
human_translation: And from where that leaving the court, acquitted, and someone says: I have to teach him liable, from where that does not bring back The verse states: “The righteous you shall not slay,”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And from where do we derive that one who leaves the court is deserving, and one says: "I have a duty to teach him," from where do we derive that they do not bring him back? The Talmud teaches: "Do not kill the righteous."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שִׁימִי בַּר אָשֵׁי: וְחִילּוּפָא לְמֵסִית, דִּכְתִיב ״לֹא תַחְמֹל וְלֹא תְכַסֶּה עָלָיו״. רַב כָּהֲנָא מַתְנֵי מִ״כִּי הָרֹג תַּהַרְגֶנּוּ״.
human_translation: Rav Shimi bar Ashi says: And the opposite of this with regard to one who entices as it is written “Neither shall you spare, neither shall you conceal him” Rav Kahana teaches “But you shall kill him [ harog tahargennu ]”
llm_translation: Rav Shimi bar Ashei said: And the exchange for the tempter, as it is written, "You shall not spare him, nor conceal him." Rav Kahana teaches: "When he strikes, you shall strike him."

hebrew_text: בְּעָא מִנֵּיהּ רַבִּי זֵירָא מֵרַב שֵׁשֶׁת: חַיָּיבֵי גָּלִיּוֹת מִנַּיִין? אָתְיָא ״רֹצֵחַ״ ״רֹצֵחַ״.
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira asked Rav Sheshet: From where those liable exiled derived “murderer” “murderer”
llm_translation: Requested from him Rabbi Zeira from Rav Sheshet: The liable of Gilioth from where? It comes "murderer" "murderer."

hebrew_text: חַיָּיבֵי מַלְקִיּוֹת מִנַּיִין? אָתְיָא ״רָשָׁע״ ״רָשָׁע״.
human_translation: From where those liable lashes derived “wicked” “wicked”
llm_translation: Those liable for lashes, from where do we derive it? It is derived from "wicked," "wicked."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: חַיָּיבֵי גָּלִיּוֹת מִנַּיִין? אַתְיָא ״רֹצֵחַ״ ״רֹצֵחַ״. חַיָּיבֵי מַלְקוֹת מִנַּיִין? אָתְיָא ״רָשָׁע״ ״רָשָׁע״.
human_translation: This is also taught From where those liable exiled derived “murderer” “murderer” From where those liable lashes derived “wicked” “wicked”
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: From where do we derive the liability of those who reveal secrets? It comes from "murderer, murderer." From where do we derive the liability of those who receive lashes? It comes from "wicked, wicked."

hebrew_text: וְאֵין מַחְזִירִין לְחוֹבָה. אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: וְהוּא שֶׁטָּעָה בְּדָבָר שֶׁאֵין הַצַּדּוּקִין מוֹדִין בּוֹ, אֲבָל טָעָה בִּדְבַר שֶׁהַצַּדּוּקִין מוֹדִין בּוֹ – זִיל קְרִי בֵּי רַב הוּא.
human_translation: But does not bring back to find liable. Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: And this where erred with regard to a matter which the Sadducees do not admit to its But erred in a matter which the Sadducees admit to its it is go learn in a children’s school,
llm_translation: And one does not return for a debt. Rabbi Hiyya bar Abba said in the name of Rabbi Yohanan: And this is when he erred in a matter that the Sadducees do not agree with, but if he erred in a matter that the Sadducees agree with - go, it is the house of Rav.

hebrew_text: בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא מֵרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: טָעָה בְּנוֹאֵף וְנוֹאֶפֶת מַהוּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַדְּמוֹקְדָךְ יְקִיד, זִיל קוּץ קָרָךְ וּצְלִי. אִיתְּמַר נָמֵי, אָמַר רַבִּי אַמֵּי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: טָעָה בְּנוֹאֵף – חוֹזֵר.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba asked of Rabbi Yoḥanan: What is erred with regard to an adulterer and adulteress, said to him: While your fire is burning, cut your squash and roast it, was also stated: Rabbi Ami says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: erred with regard to an adulterer, revokes
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates as follows: Requested from him Rabbi Chiya bar Abba from Rabbi Yochanan: If one erred with a male adulterer and a female adulterer, what is the law? He said to him: "Your kindling is a stake, go and roast it." It was stated similarly, Rabbi Ammi said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: If one erred with a male adulterer - he must return.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא הֵיכִי דָּמֵי אֵין חוֹזְרִין? אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כְּגוֹן שֶׁטָּעָה שֶׁלֹּא כְּדַרְכָּהּ.
human_translation: Rather, what are the circumstances does not revoke Rabbi Abbahu says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: where he erred in an atypical manner,
llm_translation: Rather, how so are the laws of not returning? Rabbi Abbahu said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: For example, when one plants not in its usual manner.

hebrew_text: דִּינֵי מָמוֹנוֹת הַכֹּל כּוּ׳. הַכֹּל, וַאֲפִילּוּ עֵדִים? נֵימָא מַתְנִיתִין רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה הִיא, וְלָא רַבָּנַן?
human_translation: monetary law, all all and even witnesses? Let us say the mishna Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, and not the Rabbis.
llm_translation: Laws of monetary matters, all like. All, even witnesses? Say: Mishnah Rabbi Yosei son of Rabbi Yehuda it is, and not the Rabbis?

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: ״וְעֵד אֶחָד לֹא יַעֲנֶה בְנֶפֶשׁ״ – בֵּין לִזְכוּת בֵּין לְחוֹבָה. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: עוֹנֶה לִזְכוּת, וְאֵין עוֹנֶה לְחוֹבָה.
human_translation: As it is taught “But one witness shall not testify against any person whether to acquit or to liable; Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: may answer to acquit, but may not answer to liable.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: "And one witness shall not answer against a person" - whether for acquittal or for liability. Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: he testifies for acquittal, but does not testify for liability.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: בְּאֶחָד מִן הַתַּלְמִידִים, וְדִבְרֵי הַכֹּל.
human_translation: Rav Pappa says: to one of the students and all agree
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: In one of the disciples, and the words of everyone.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר יְהוּדָה? דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״עֵד אֶחָד לֹא יַעֲנֶה בְנֶפֶשׁ לָמוּת״. לָמוּת הוּא דְּאֵינוֹ עוֹנֶה, אֲבָל לִזְכוּת עוֹנֶה. וְרַבָּנַן? אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: מִשּׁוּם דְּמִיחֲזֵי כְּנוֹגֵעַ בְּעֵדוּתוֹ.
human_translation: What is the reason of Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda? As the verse states: “But one witness shall not testify against any person that he die.” That he die is which he does not testify, but he does testify to acquit. And the Rabbis? Reish Lakish says: because it appears as though he is biased in his testimony.
llm_translation: What is the reason for Rabbi Yosei bar Yehuda's opinion? As the verse states: "A single witness shall not respond against a person for any iniquity or for any sin." It is for death that he does not respond, but for acquittal he does respond. And the Sages? Reish Lakish said: Because it appears as though he is touching his testimony.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן, הַאי ״לָמוּת״ מַאי דָּרְשִׁי בֵּיהּ? מוֹקְמִי לֵיהּ בְּאֶחָד מִן הַתַּלְמִידִים. כִּדְתַנְיָא: אָמַר אֶחָד מִן הָעֵדִים ״יֵשׁ לִי לְלַמֵּד עָלָיו זְכוּת״, מִנַּיִין שֶׁאֵין שׁוֹמְעִין לוֹ? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״עֵד אֶחָד לֹא יַעֲנֶה״. מִנַּיִין לְאֶחָד מִן הַתַּלְמִידִים שֶׁאָמַר ״יֵשׁ לִי לְלַמֵּד עָלָיו חוֹבָה״, מִנַּיִין שֶׁאֵין שׁוֹמְעִין לוֹ? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אֶחָד לֹא יַעֲנֶה בְנֶפֶשׁ לָמוּת״.
human_translation: And the Rabbis, what they interpret this “That he die”? They establish it with regard to one of the students. As it is taught one of the witnesses said: I have to teach acquit him, from where that does not listen to him? The verse states: “One witness shall not testify.” From where that one of the students who said: I have to teach him liable, from where that does not listen to him? The verse states: one shall not testify against any person that he die.”
llm_translation: The sages, what did they expound in this word "to die"? They establish it with one of the disciples. As it was taught: If one of the witnesses says, "I have merit to teach in his favor," from where do we know that we do not listen to him? The Scripture says: "One witness shall not answer." From where do we know for one of the disciples who says, "I have an obligation to teach in his favor," from where do we know that we do not listen to him? The Scripture says: "One shall not answer in a matter of death."

hebrew_text: דִּינֵי נְפָשׁוֹת: הַמְלַמֵּד כּוּ׳. אָמַר רַב: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא בִּשְׁעַת מַשָּׂא וּמַתָּן, אֲבָל בִּשְׁעַת גְּמַר דִּין – מְלַמֵּד זְכוּת חוֹזֵר וּמְלַמֵּד חוֹבָה.
human_translation: capital law, one who teaches Rav says: They taught only with regard to the time of deliberations but at the time of verdict, teaches acquit may return and teach liable.
llm_translation: Laws of capital cases: one who teaches. Rav said: They only taught this regarding the time of deliberation and negotiation, but at the time of final judgment - one who teaches merit, goes back and teaches liability.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: לְמׇחֳרָת מַשְׁכִּימִין וּבָאִין. הַמְזַכֶּה אוֹמֵר: ״אֲנִי הַמְזַכֶּה, וּמְזַכֶּה אֲנִי בִּמְקוֹמִי״. הַמְחַיֵּיב אוֹמֵר: ״אֲנִי הַמְחַיֵּיב, וּמְחַיֵּיב אֲנִי בִּמְקוֹמִי״. הַמְלַמֵּד חוֹבָה מְלַמֵּד זְכוּת, אֲבָל הַמְלַמֵּד זְכוּת אֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לַחֲזוֹר וּלְלַמֵּד חוֹבָה.
human_translation: raises an objection The following day, arise early and come One who acquit says: I acquit, and I acquit in my place, And one who deem liable says: I deem liable, and I deem liable in my place. One who taught liable may teach acquit, but one who taught acquit may not teach liable.
llm_translation: Challenger: The next day they rise early and come. The one who claims to be the one who benefits says, "I am the one who benefits, and I benefit in my place." The one who admits liability says, "I am the one who admits liability, and I admit liability in my place." One who teaches an obligation teaches merit, but one who teaches merit cannot go back and teach obligation.

hebrew_text: וְהָא לַמׇּחֳרָת גְּמַר דִּין הוּא, וְלִיטַעְמָיךְ, לַמׇּחֳרָת מַשָּׂא וּמַתָּן מִי לֵיכָּא? כִּי קָתָנֵי בִּשְׁעַת מַשָּׂא וּמַתָּן.
human_translation: But the following day is the verdict, And according to your reasoning, are there no deliberations on the following day? when teaches with regard to the time of deliberations.
llm_translation: And this, for the next day, is a completed judgment, and to what can you compare it? For the next day, is there any buying and selling? As it is taught at the time of buying and selling.
