hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: דָּנִין אֵלּוּ כְּנֶגֶד אֵלּוּ, עַד שֶׁיִּרְאֶה אֶחָד מִן הַמְחַיְּיבִין דִּבְרֵי הַמְזַכִּין. וְאִם אִיתַהּ, לִיתְנֵי נָמֵי אִיפְּכָא! תַּנָּא אַזְּכוּת קָא מְהַדַּר, אַחוֹבָה לָא קָא מְהַדַּר.
human_translation: Come hear they deliberate these against those until one of those who deems liable sees the statements of those who acquit And if it is so teaches to acquit may return and teach liable, let also teach the opposite The tanna is searching for acquittal, is not searching for liability.
llm_translation: Come and hear: We judge these against those, until one of the obligators sees the words of the acquitters. And if it is so, let the opposite be said! A Mishnaic teaching is being repeated, acquittal is not being repeated.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר חֲנִינָא: אֶחָד מִן הַתַּלְמִידִים שֶׁזִּיכָּה וָמֵת – רוֹאִין אוֹתוֹ כְּאִילּוּ חַי וְעוֹמֵד בִּמְקוֹמוֹ. וְאַמַּאי? נֵימָא: אִילּוּ הֲוָה קַיָּים, [הֲוָה] הָדַר בֵּיהּ! הַשְׁתָּא מִיהָא לָא הֲדַר בֵּיהּ.
human_translation: Come hear As Rabbi Yosei bar Ḥanina says: one of the students who acquit and died, views him as if alive and standing in his place But why? let us say: if were alive, retract Now, in any event, did not retract from
llm_translation: Come and hear, for Rabbi Yosei bar Hanina said: One of the disciples who was meritorious and died - they see him as if he is alive and standing in his place. And why? Say: If he had been alive, he would have been honored! Now, since he is no longer alive, he is not honored.

hebrew_text: וְהָא שְׁלַחוּ מִתָּם: לְדִבְרֵי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר חֲנִינָא, מוּצָא מִכְּלַל רַבֵּינוּ! ״אֵין מוּצָא״ אִיתְּמַר.
human_translation: But sent from there, According to the statement of Rabbi Yosei bar Ḥanina, a dispute with our teacher, was stated not a dispute
llm_translation: And he sent from there: according to the words of Rabbi Yosei bar Hanina, it is found from the category of our master! "It is not found" was stated.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: שְׁנֵי סוֹפְרֵי הַדַּיָּינִין עוֹמְדִין לִפְנֵיהֶן, אֶחָד מִן הַיָּמִין וְאֶחָד מִן הַשְּׂמֹאל, וְכוֹתְבִין דִּבְרֵי הַמְזַכִּין וְדִבְרֵי הַמְחַיְּיבִין.
human_translation: Come hear two judges’ scribes stand before one on the right, and one on the left, and they write the statements of those who acquit and the statements of those who find liable.
llm_translation: Come and hear: Two scribes of the judges stand before them, one on the right and one on the left, and write the words of those who seek to acquit and the words of those who seek to inculpate.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא דִּבְרֵי הַמְחַיְּיבִין, לִמְחַר חָזוּ טַעְמָא אַחֲרִינָא וּבָעוּ לְמֶעְבַּד הֲלָנַת דִּין. אֶלָּא דִּבְרֵי הַמְזַכִּין, מַאי טַעְמָא? לָאו מִשּׁוּם דְּאִי חָזוּ טַעְמָא אַחֲרִינָא לְחוֹבָה, לָא מַשְׁגְּחִינַן בְּהוּ?
human_translation: Granted, statements of those who find liable on the following day they see another reason And is required to perform a suspension of the trial But what is the reason the statements of those who acquit not because if see another reason to liable, we do not pay heed to them,
llm_translation: In truth, the words of those who inculpate, the next day they saw another reason and sought to retract the judgment. But the words of those who exonerate, what is the reason? Is it not because if they saw another reason to inculpate, we do not concern ourselves with it?

hebrew_text: לֹא, כְּדֵי שֶׁלֹּא יֹאמְרוּ שְׁנַיִם טַעַם אֶחָד מִשְּׁנֵי מִקְרָאוֹת. כְּדִבְעָא מִינֵּיהּ רַבִּי אַסִּי מֵרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אָמְרוּ שְׁנַיִם טַעַם אֶחָד מִשְּׁנֵי מִקְרָאוֹת, מַהוּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֵין מוֹנִין לָהֶן אֶלָּא אֶחָד.
human_translation: No, so that two should not say one explanation from two verses. As Rabbi Asi asked of Rabbi Yoḥanan: two say one explanation from two verses, what is Rabbi Yoḥanan said to him: We count them only as one,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: No, so that they should not say two tastes from two verses. As it was taught in the school of Rabbi Assi from Rabbi Yochanan: They said two tastes from two verses, what is the ruling? He said to them: We only count them as one.

hebrew_text: מְנָהָנֵי מִילֵּי? אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: דְּאָמַר קְרָא ״אַחַת דִּבֶּר אֱלֹהִים שְׁתַּיִם זוּ שָׁמָעְתִּי כִּי עֹז לֵאלֹהִים״. מִקְרָא אֶחָד יוֹצֵא לְכַמָּה טְעָמִים, וְאֵין טַעַם אֶחָד יוֹצֵא מִכַּמָּה מִקְרָאוֹת. דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל תָּנָא: ״וּכְפַטִּישׁ יְפֹצֵץ סָלַע״ – מָה פַּטִּישׁ זֶה מִתְחַלֵּק לְכַמָּה נִיצוֹצוֹת, אַף מִקְרָא אֶחָד יוֹצֵא לְכַמָּה טְעָמִים.
human_translation: From where is this matter Abaye says: As the verse states: “God has spoken once, twice I have heard this; that strength belongs to God” One verse emerge several explanations, but one explanation does not emerge from several verses. the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught and like a hammer that breaks the rock in pieces” Just as this hammer breaks into several fragments, so too, one verse and emerge several explanations.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: What are the sources of these matters? Abaye said: As the verse says, "God has spoken once, twice have I heard that power belongs to God." One verse yields many interpretations, and one interpretation does not emerge from many verses. The school of Rabbi Ishmael taught: "And as a hammer that breaks the rock in pieces" - just as this hammer splits into many sparks, so too, one verse yields many interpretations.

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי דָּמֵי טַעַם אֶחָד מִשְּׁנֵי מִקְרָאוֹת? אָמַר רַב זְבִיד, כְּדִתְנַן: מִזְבֵּחַ מְקַדֵּשׁ אֶת הָרָאוּי לוֹ.
human_translation: What is considered one explanation from two verses? Rav Zevid says: As we learned the altar sanctifies that are suited for it,
llm_translation: "How are the reasons of one of the two verses similar? Rav Zevid said, as we learned: 'An altar sanctifies what is fitting for it.'"

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: כׇּל הָרָאוּי לָאִשִּׁים, אִם עָלָה – לֹא יֵרֵד, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הָעֹלָה עַל מוֹקְדָה״. מָה עוֹלָה שֶׁהִיא רְאוּיָה לָאִשִּׁים, אִם עָלְתָה – לֹא תֵּרֵד, אַף כֹּל שֶׁהוּא רָאוּי לָאִשִּׁים, אִם עָלָה – לֹא יֵרֵד.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua says: Any that is suited to the fire if it ascended it shall not descend. as it is stated: the burnt-offering on the pyre Just as a burnt-offering that is suited to the fire if it ascended, it shall not descend, so too any that is suited to the fire if it ascended, it shall not descend.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua says: Anything fitting for women, if it ascends, it shall not descend, as it is stated: "It goes up in smoke upon the altar." Just as an offering that is fitting for women, if it ascends, it shall not descend, so too, anything that is fitting for women, if it ascends, it shall not descend.

hebrew_text: רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: כׇּל הָרָאוּי לַמִּזְבֵּחַ, אִם עָלָה – לֹא יֵרֵד, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הִיא הָעֹלָה עַל מוֹקְדָה עַל הַמִּזְבֵּחַ״. מָה עוֹלָה שֶׁהִיא רְאוּיָה לְגַבֵּי מִזְבֵּחַ – אִם עָלְתָה לֹא תֵּרֵד, אַף כֹּל שֶׁהוּא רָאוּי לְמִזְבֵּחַ – אִם עָלָה לֹא יֵרֵד.
human_translation: Rabban Gamliel says: any that is suited to the altar, if it ascended, it shall not descend, as it is stated: “It is the burnt-offering on the pyre upon the altar,” Just as a burnt-offering that is fit for the altar, if it ascended, it shall not descend, so too any that is fit for the altar, if it ascended, it shall not descend.
llm_translation: Rabban Gamliel says: Anything fitting for the altar, if it ascended - it shall not descend, as it is stated: "It is the burnt offering that ascends upon the altar." Just as a burnt offering that is fitting for the altar, if it ascended it shall not descend, so too anything that is fitting for the altar, if it ascended it shall not descend.

hebrew_text: וְתַרְוַיְיהוּ מַאי קָמְרַבּוּ? פְּסוּלִין. מָר מַיְיתֵי לַהּ מִ״מּוֹקְדָה״, וּמָר מַיְיתֵי לַהּ מִ״מִּזְבֵּחַ״.
human_translation: And what do the two of them include Disqualified Sage, brings this from “on the pyre,” and Sage, brings this from altar.”
llm_translation: And what is their dispute about? Invalid. One Master brings it from "the hearth," and the other Master brings it from "the altar."

hebrew_text: וְהָא הָתָם מִיפְלָג פְּלִיגִי, דְּקָתָנֵי סֵיפָא: אֵין בֵּין דִּבְרֵי רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל לְדִבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אֶלָּא הַדָּם וְהַנְּסָכִים, שֶׁרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: לֹא יֵרְדוּ, וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: יֵרְדוּ.
human_translation: But there, disagree, As the latter clause teaches: The difference between the statement of Rabban Gamliel and the statement of Rabbi Yehoshua is only blood and libations, as Rabban Gamliel says: They shall not descend, and Rabbi Yehoshua says: They shall descend,
llm_translation: And there, they argue, as it is taught in the latter part: There is no difference between the words of Rabban Gamliel and the words of Rabbi Yehoshua except for the blood and the libations, for Rabban Gamliel says: They shall not descend, and Rabbi Yehoshua says: They shall descend.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: כִּדְתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי אוֹמֵר: מִתּוֹךְ שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר
human_translation: Rather, Rav Pappa says: as it is taught Rabbi Yosei HaGelili says: From the fact that it is stated:
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Papa said: As it was taught, Rabbi Yosei HaGalili says: Because it is stated

hebrew_text: ״כָּל הַנּוֹגֵעַ בַּמִּזְבֵּחַ יִקְדָּשׁ״ – שׁוֹמֵעַ אֲנִי, בֵּין רָאוּי בֵּין שֶׁאֵינוֹ רָאוּי? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״כְּבָשִׂים״ – מָה כְּבָשִׂים רְאוּיִין, אַף כֹּל רָאוּי. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: ״עוֹלָה״ – מָה עוֹלָה רְאוּיָה, אַף כֹּל רָאוּי.
human_translation: “Whatsoever touches the altar shall be sanctified” I derive whether suited or unsuited The verse states: lambs Just as lambs are suited so too, everything suited Rabbi Akiva says: a burnt-offering Just as a burnt-offering is suited so too, everything suited
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Whoever touches the altar shall be consecrated" - I say, whether fitting or not fitting? The Scripture teaches: "sheep" - just as sheep that are fitting, so too, all are fitting. Rabbi Akiva says: "burnt offering" - just as a burnt offering that is fitting, so too, all are fitting.

hebrew_text: וְתַרְוַיְיהוּ מַאי קָא מְמַעֲטוּ? פְּסוּלֵי. מָר מַיְיתֵי לַהּ מִ״כְּבָשִׂים״, וּמָר מַיְיתֵי לַהּ מֵ״עוֹלָה״.
human_translation: And what do the two of them exclude Disqualified Sage, brings this from “lambs,” and Sage, brings this from “burnt-offering.”
llm_translation: And what are they diminishing? Disqualifications. One Master brings it from "rams," and one Master brings it from "burnt offerings."

hebrew_text: וְהָאָמַר רַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה: עוֹלַת הָעוֹף פְּסוּלָה אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ. מַאן דְּמַיְיתֵי לַהּ מִ״כְּבָשִׂים״ – כְּבָשִׂים אִין, אֲבָל עוֹלַת הָעוֹף לָא. וּמַאן דְּמַיְיתֵי לַהּ מֵ״עוֹלָה״ – אֲפִילּוּ עוֹלַת הָעוֹף נָמֵי.
human_translation: But doesn’t Rav Adda bar Ahava say between them a disqualified bird burnt-offering? The one who brings this from “lambs” Lambs, yes, but a bird burnt-offering not. And the one who brings this from “burnt-offering” a bird burnt-offering also
llm_translation: And it was said by Rav Adda bar Ahava: A bird offering is disqualified, there is a difference between them. Whoever compares it to "lambs" - like lambs it is not, but a bird offering is not. And whoever compares it to "an elevation offering" - even a bird offering also.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: כִּדְתַנְיָא, ״דָּם יֵחָשֵׁב לָאִישׁ הַהוּא דָּם שָׁפָךְ״ – לְרַבּוֹת אֶת הַזּוֹרֵק, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל.
human_translation: Rather, Rav Ashi said: as it is taught blood shall be imputed unto that man; he shed blood; to include one who sprinkles the statement of Rabbi Yishmael.
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Ashi said: As it was taught, "The blood shall be imputed to that man who shed it" - to include the one who throws it, the words of Rabbi Yishmael.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: ״אוֹ זָבַח״ – לְרַבּוֹת אֶת הַזּוֹרֵק. וְתַרְוַיְיהוּ מַאי קָא מְרַבּוּ? זְרִיקָה. מָר מַיְיתֵי לַהּ מִ״דָּם יֵחָשֵׁב״, וּמָר מַיְיתֵי לַהּ מֵ״אוֹ זָבַח״.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva says or sacrifice” to include one who sprinkles What do the two include sprinkling Sage, brings this from “blood shall be imputed,” and Sage, brings this from “or sacrifice.”
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: "Or 'zavach' - to include the one who sprinkles. And what do both of them come to include? Sprinkling. One Master derives it from 'its blood shall be reckoned,' and the other Master derives it from 'or sacrifice.'"

hebrew_text: וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: שָׁחַט וְזָרַק אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ. לְדִבְרֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל, אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב אֶלָּא אַחַת; לְדִבְרֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, חַיָּיב שְׁתַּיִם.
human_translation: But doesn’t Rabbi Abbahu say between them slaughtered and sprinkled according to the statement of Rabbi Yishmael he is liable only one according to the statement of Rabbi Akiva liable two
llm_translation: The text reads: "And Rabbi Avahu said: If one slaughters and throws, there is a distinction between them. According to the words of Rabbi Yishmael, he is only liable for one; according to the words of Rabbi Akiva, he is liable for two."

hebrew_text: הָא אִיתְּמַר עֲלַהּ, אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: אַף לְדִבְרֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא נָמֵי אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב אֶלָּא אַחַת, דְּאָמַר קְרָא ״שָׁם תַּעֲלֶה עֹלוֹתֶיךָ וְשָׁם תַּעֲשֶׂה״. עָרְבִינְהוּ רַחֲמָנָא לְכוּלְּהוּ עֲשִׂיּוֹת.
human_translation: Wasn’t it stated with regard to that Abaye says: Even according to the statement of Rabbi Akiva, he is liable only one as the verse states: there you shall offer your burnt-offerings, and there you shall do The Merciful One combined all the actions
llm_translation: Here is the translation of the Talmudic text: It was stated about it, Abaye said: Even according to the words of Rabbi Akiva, he is also liable only once, as the verse says, "There you shall bring your burnt offerings and there you shall do." The Merciful One has mixed them all together for actions.

hebrew_text: דִּינֵי מָמוֹנוֹת דָּנִין בַּיּוֹם וְכוּ׳. (סִימָן: מִשְׁפָּט, מַעֲנֶה, מַטֶּה.) מְנָהָנֵי מִילֵּי? אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר פָּפָּא: דְּאָמַר קְרָא ״וְשָׁפְטוּ אֶת הָעָם בְּכׇל עֵת״.
human_translation: monetary law, judges during the daytime, a mnemonic Judgment, answer, incline. From where are these matters Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Pappa says: As the verse states: “And let them judge the people at all times”
llm_translation: Laws of monetary matters are judged during the day, etc. (Sign: Judgment, Response, Staff.) Enjoyable words? Rabbi Chiya bar Papa said: As the verse says, "And they shall judge the people at all times."

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, תְּחִלַּת דִּין נָמֵי? כִּדְרָבָא, דְּרָבָא רָמֵי: כְּתִיב ״וְשָׁפְטוּ אֶת הָעָם בְּכׇל עֵת״, וּכְתִיב ״וְהָיָה בְּיוֹם הַנְחִילוֹ אֶת בָּנָיו״. הָא כֵּיצַד? יוֹם לִתְחִלַּת דִּין, לַיְלָה לִגְמַר דִּין.
human_translation: If that is so the initial of the trial as well. in accordance with of Rava, as Rava raises a contradiction is written “And let them judge the people at all times,” and is written “Then it shall be on the day that he causes his sons to inherit How day with regard to the initial of the trial, night with regard to the verdict.
llm_translation: Thus, is it that the beginning of the judgment is during the day? As Rava said, for Rava raised an objection: It is written, "And they shall judge the people at all times," and it is written, "And it shall be on the day that he makes his sons heirs." How so? The day is for the commencement of the judgment, the night is for the completion of the judgment.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִיתִין דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר, דְּתַנְיָא: הָיָה רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר, מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״עַל פִּיהֶם יִהְיֶה כׇּל רִיב וְכׇל נָגַע״? וְכִי מָה עִנְיַן רִיבִים אֵצֶל נְגָעִים?
human_translation: The mishna is not in accordance with Rabbi Meir. As it is taught Rabbi Meir would say: What the verse states “According to their word shall every dispute and every leprous sore be” And what do disputes have to do with leprous sores?
llm_translation: Mishnah that is not like Rabbi Meir, as it was taught: Rabbi Meir would say, what is the meaning of the verse "According to their word shall every controversy and every plague be"? And what is the connection between controversies and plagues?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מַקִּישׁ רִיבִים לִנְגָעִים: מָה נְגָעִים בַּיּוֹם, דִּכְתִיב ״וּבְיוֹם הֵרָאוֹת בּוֹ״, אַף רִיבִים בַּיּוֹם. וּמָה נְגָעִים שֶׁלֹּא בְּסוֹמִין, דִּכְתִיב ״לְכׇל מַרְאֵה עֵינֵי הַכֹּהֵן״, אַף רִיבִים שֶׁלֹּא בְּסוֹמִין. וּמַקִּישׁ נְגָעִים לְרִיבִים: מָה רִיבִים שֶׁלֹּא בִּקְרוֹבִים, אַף נְגָעִים שֶׁלֹּא בִּקְרוֹבִים.
human_translation: Rather, juxtaposes disputes to leprous sores, just as leprous sores in the daytime, as it is written: “And on the day when appears in him so too disputes in the daytime. And just as leprous sores not by blind as it is written: “As far as appears to the priest” so too disputes not by blind judges. And juxtaposes leprous sores to disputes, just as disputes not by relatives so too leprous sores by not a relative
llm_translation: Rather, it draws a comparison between nega'im and rib'im: Just as nega'im occur during the day, as it is written "and on the day that it appears in him," so too rib'im occur during the day. And just as nega'im that are not in hidden places, as it is written "for all who have the appearance of the kohen's eyes," so too rib'im that are not in hidden places. And it draws a comparison between nega'im and rib'im: Just as rib'im that are not in close proximity, so too nega'im that are not in close proximity.

hebrew_text: אִי מָה רִיבִים בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה – אַף נְגָעִים בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה? וְדִין הוּא: מָמוֹנוֹ בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה, גּוּפוֹ לָא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְהוּבָא אֶל אַהֲרֹן הַכֹּהֵן אוֹ אֶל אֶחָד וְגוֹ׳״. הָא לָמַדְתָּ שֶׁאֲפִילּוּ כֹּהֵן אֶחָד רוֹאֶה אֶת הַנְּגָעִים.
human_translation: If just as disputes by three so too leprous sores by three And this a logical inference: money by three not all the more so himself the verse states: “And he shall be brought to Aaron the priest or to one you learned that even one priest views leprous sores.
llm_translation: Disputes in three - also plagues in three? And it is a law: his money in three, his body all the more so? The Talmud teaches: "And he shall be brought to Aaron the priest or to one of his sons." You learn that even one priest sees the plagues.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא סַמְיָא דַּהֲוָה בְּשִׁבְבוּתֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, דַּהֲוָה דָּאֵין דִּינָא, וְלָא אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן וְלָא מִידֵּי. הֵיכִי עָבֵיד הָכִי? וְהָא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הֲלָכָה כִּסְתַם מִשְׁנָה, וּתְנַן: כׇּל הַכָּשֵׁר לָדוּן כָּשֵׁר לְהָעִיד, וְיֵשׁ שֶׁכָּשֵׁר לְהָעִיד וְאֵין כָּשֵׁר לָדוּן. וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: לְאֵתוֹיֵי סוֹמֵא בְּאַחַת מֵעֵינָיו.
human_translation: a certain blind man who was in the neighborhood of Rabbi Yoḥanan who would serve as a judge, and Rabbi Yoḥanan did not say anything to him. How did he do this, But didn’t Rabbi Yoḥanan say: halakha in accordance with an unattributed mishna, and we learned Anyone who is fit to judge fit to testify, but there are who fit to testify but not fit to judge. And Rabbi Yoḥanan says: to include blind in one of his eyes,
llm_translation: That certain Samaritan who was in the neighborhood of Rabbi Yochanan, who was a judge, and Rabbi Yochanan did not say to him, and not from him. How did he do this? And Rabbi Yochanan said: The halacha is like the anonymous Mishnah, and we learned: Anyone who is qualified to testify is qualified to judge, and there are those who are qualified to testify but not qualified to judge. And Rabbi Yochanan said: To bring a blind person with one of his eyes.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן סְתָמָא אַחְרִיתָא אַשְׁכַּח: דִּינֵי מָמוֹנוֹת דָּנִין בַּיּוֹם, וְגוֹמְרִין בַּלַּיְלָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan found another unattributed mishna, monetary law, judges during the daytime and may conclude at night.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan stama found: monetary laws adjudicate during the day, and conclude at night.

hebrew_text: מַאי אוּלְמֵיהּ דְּהַאי סְתָמָא מֵהַאי סְתָמָא? אִי בָּעֵית אֵימָא: סְתָמָא דְּרַבִּים עֲדִיף, וְאִי בָּעֵית אֵימָא: מִשּׁוּם דְּקָתָנֵי לַהּ גַּבֵּי הִלְכְתָא דְּדִינָא.
human_translation: what the strength of this unattributed than that unattributed If you wish, say an unattributed of many preferable, And if you wish, say because teaches this in the context of the halakhot of judgment.
llm_translation: What is the difference between this anonymous Mishnah and that anonymous Mishnah? If you wish, say: An anonymous Mishnah of the public is preferable, and if you wish, say: Because it teaches him the halakha of the law.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי מֵאִיר, הַאי ״וְשָׁפְטוּ אֶת הָעָם בְּכׇל עֵת״ מַאי דָּרֵישׁ בֵּיהּ? אָמַר רָבָא: לְאֵיתוֹיֵי יוֹם הַמְעוּנָּן. דִּתְנַן: אֵין רוֹאִין אֶת הַנְּגָעִים שַׁחֲרִית, וּבֵין הָעַרְבַּיִם, וְלֹא בְּתוֹךְ הַבַּיִת, וְלֹא בְּיוֹם הַמְעוּנָּן, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁכֵּהָה נִרְאֵית עַזָּה. וְלֹא בַּצׇּהֳרַיִם, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁעַזָּה נִרְאֵית כֵּהָה.
human_translation: And what Rabbi Meir interpret this “And let them judge the people at all times” Rava said: to include a cloudy day, As we learned does not view leprous sores morning and afternoon, and not in a house, and not on a cloudy day. because a dull appears bright, And not at midday, because a bright appears dull
llm_translation: Rabbi Meir: This "And they shall judge the people at all times," what is it that he expounds in it? Rava said: For the clarity of a cloudy day. As we learned: One does not inspect the afflictions in the morning, or between the evenings, and not inside the house, and not on a cloudy day, because it appears bright. And not in the afternoon, because it appears dim.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי מֵאִיר, הַאי ״בְּיוֹם הַנְחִילוֹ אֶת בָּנָיו״ מַאי עָבֵיד לֵיהּ? הַהוּא מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְכִדְתָנֵי רַבָּה בַּר חֲנִינָא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן: ״וְהָיָה בְּיוֹם הַנְחִילוֹ אֶת בָּנָיו״ – בַּיּוֹם אַתָּה מַפִּיל נַחֲלוֹת, וְאִי אַתָּה מַפִּיל נַחֲלוֹת בַּלַּיְלָה. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, מַאן דְּשָׁכֵיב בִּימָמָא יִרְתוּן לֵיהּ בְּנֵיהּ, וּמַאן דְּשָׁכֵיב בְּלֵילְיָא לָא יִרְתוּן לֵיהּ בְּנֵיהּ?
human_translation: And what Rabbi Meir interpret this “On the day that he causes his sons to inherit”? He requires that to that Rabba bar Ḥanina taught in the presence of Rav Naḥman: “Then it shall be on the day that he causes his sons to inherit during the day that you distribute inheritances, but you cannot distribute inheritances at night. said to him: if that is so, one who dies during the day his children inherit him but one who dies at night, his children do not inherit him,
llm_translation: Rabbi Meir: What does this mean, "on the day he bequeaths his sons"? He should divide his inheritance during the day, and not divide his inheritance at night. Rabba bar Chanina taught before Rav Nachman: "And it shall be on the day he bequeaths his sons" - on the day you shall divide his inheritance, and if you do not divide his inheritance during the day. He said to him: Rather, from now on, whoever sleeps during the day, his sons shall inherit him, and whoever sleeps at night, his sons shall not inherit him.

hebrew_text: דִּילְמָא דִּין נַחֲלוֹת קָאָמְרַתְּ? דְּתַנְיָא: ״וְהָיְתָה לִבְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל לְחֻקַּת מִשְׁפָּט״ – אוֹרְעָה כָּל הַפָּרָשָׁה כֻּולָּהּ לִהְיוֹת דִּין.
human_translation: Perhaps you are stating adjudication of inheritances. as it is taught “And it shall be for the children of Israel a statute of judgment” the entire portion is placed [ ure’a ] to be judgment,
llm_translation: Perhaps she is speaking about the laws of inheritances? As it was taught: "And it shall be for the children of Israel a statute of judgment" – the entire portion is interpreted to be a judgment.

hebrew_text: כִּדְרַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב, דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: שְׁלֹשָׁה שֶׁנִּכְנְסוּ לְבַקֵּר אֶת הַחוֹלֶה, רָצוּ – כּוֹתְבִין, רָצוּ – עוֹשִׂין דִּין. שְׁנַיִם – כּוֹתְבִין וְאֵין עוֹשִׂין דִּין.
human_translation: And in accordance with that Rav Yehuda Rav says, as Rav Yehuda says Rav says: three people who entered to visit an ill person, wish they write they wish, they act judgment, two they write but they cannot act judgment,
llm_translation: As Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav, as Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: Three who come to visit the sick, if they wish - they write a document, if they wish - they conduct a judgment. If two come, they write a document but do not conduct a judgment.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא בַּיּוֹם, אֲבָל בַּלַּיְלָה כּוֹתְבִין וְאֵין עוֹשִׂין דִּין, מִשּׁוּם דְּהָווּ לְהוּ עֵדִים, וְאֵין עֵד נַעֲשֶׂה דַּיָּין. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִין, הָכִי קָאָמֵינָא.
human_translation: And Rav Ḥisda says: taught only during the day; but at night, they write but they cannot act judgment. because they are witnesses and a witness cannot become a judge, said to Yes, so I was saying.
llm_translation: And Rav Hisda said: They only taught this regarding the day, but at night they may write and not carry out judgment, because witnesses were present, and a witness cannot become a judge. He said to him: No, this is what I meant.

hebrew_text: דִּינֵי נְפָשׁוֹת דָּנִין בַּיּוֹם וְכוּ׳. מְנָהָנֵי מִילֵּי? אָמַר רַב שִׁימִי בַּר חִיָּיא: אָמַר קְרָא, ״וְהוֹקַע אוֹתָם לַה׳ נֶגֶד הַשָּׁמֶשׁ״. אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: מִנַּיִין לְהוֹקָעָה שֶׁהִיא תְּלִיָּיה? דִּכְתִיב: ״וְהוֹקַעֲנוּם לַה׳ בְּגִבְעַת שָׁאוּל בְּחִיר ה׳״.
human_translation: capital law, judges during the daytime, From where are these matters Rav Shimi bar Ḥiyya says: The verse states “And hang [ hoka ] them unto the Lord, facing the sun” Rav Ḥisda says: From where that hoka’a is hanging? as it is written: “ Vehoka’anum unto the Lord in Gibeah of Saul, the chosen of the Lord”
llm_translation: Laws of capital cases are judged during the day, etc. What is the source for these matters? Rav Shimi bar Chiya said: The verse states, "And they shall be hanged up before the Lord against the sun." Rav Chisda said: From where do we derive that hanging is a form of execution? As it is written, "And they hanged them up unto the Lord in Gibeah of Saul, the chosen of the Lord."

hebrew_text: וּכְתִיב: ״וַתִּקַּח רִצְפָּה בַת אַיָּה אֶת הַשַּׂק וַתַּטֵּהוּ לָהּ אֶל הַצּוּר בִּתְחִלַּת קָצִיר״.
human_translation: And it is written: “And Rizpah, daughter of Aiah, took sackcloth and spread it for her upon the rock, from the beginning of harvest
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it is written: "And Rizpah the daughter of Aiah took sackcloth and spread it for herself upon the rock, from the beginning of harvest."

hebrew_text: וּכְתִיב: ״וַיֹּאמֶר ה׳ אֶל מֹשֶׁה קַח אֶת כׇּל רָאשֵׁי הָעָם״. אִם הָעָם חָטְאוּ, רָאשֵׁי הָעָם מָה חָטְאוּ?
human_translation: And it is written: “And the Lord said unto Moses: Take all the chiefs of the people, If the nation transgressed, what the chiefs of the people transgress?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it is written: "And Hashem said to Moshe, 'Take all the leaders of the people.'" If the people sinned, what did the leaders of the people sin?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: אָמַר לוֹ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לְמֹשֶׁה, חַלֵּק לָהֶם בָּתֵּי דִינִין. מַאי טַעְמָא? אִילֵּימָא מִשּׁוּם שֶׁאֵין דָּנִין שְׁנַיִם בְּיוֹם אֶחָד? וְהָאָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא בִּשְׁתֵּי מִיתוֹת, אֲבָל בְּמִיתָה אַחַת דָּנִין!
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Rav says: the Holy One, Blessed be He, said to Moses: Apportion courts for What is the reason If we say due to that does not judge two in one day, But doesn’t Rav Ḥisda say: taught only with regard to two types of death But does judge of one type of death,
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: The Holy One, blessed be He, said to Moses, "Allocate for them courts of justice." What is the reason? Should we say it is because we do not judge two cases in one day? But didn't Rav Hisda say: They only taught this regarding two death penalties, but for one death penalty, they do judge!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, כְּדֵי שֶׁיָּשׁוּב חֲרוֹן אַף מִיִּשְׂרָאֵל.
human_translation: Rather, in order that the fierce anger may turn away from Israel.
llm_translation: Rather, in order that the anger of the Lord may turn away from the children of Israel.

hebrew_text: דִּינֵי מָמוֹנוֹת גּוֹמְרִין בּוֹ בַּיּוֹם כּוּ׳. מְנָהָנֵי מִילֵּי?
human_translation: monetary law, conclude on that same day, From where are these matters
llm_translation: Laws of monetary matters we conclude in it on the day twenty. Delightful words?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: דְּאָמַר קְרָא, ״מְלֵאֲתִי מִשְׁפָּט צֶדֶק יָלִין בָּהּ וְעַתָּה מְרַצְּחִים״. וְרָבָא אָמַר מֵהָכָא: ״אַשְּׁרוּ חָמוֹץ״ – אַשְּׁרוּ דַּיָּין שֶׁמְּחַמֵּץ אֶת דִּינוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina said: The verse states “She that was full of justice, righteousness lodged in her, but now murderers” And Rava says from here: relieve [ ashru ] the oppressed [ ḥamotz ]” Praise [ ashru ] judge who delays [ meḥametz ] his verdict
llm_translation: Rabbi Chanina said: As the verse states, "Righteousness lodges in her, but now murderers." And Rava said from here: "Woe to the one who mixes." - Woe to the judge who mixes his judgment.

hebrew_text: וְאִידַּךְ: ״אַשְּׁרוּ חָמוֹץ״, וְלֹא חוֹמֵץ. וְאִידַּךְ, הַאי ״מְלֵאֲתִי מִשְׁפָּט״ מַאי עָבֵיד לֵיהּ?
human_translation: And the other Relieve the robbery victim [ ḥamotz ], but not the robber [ ḥometz ], And the other what does he do with this “She that was full of justice,
llm_translation: And the other opinion: "Ashru chamotz," and not chometz. And the other, this "meleati mishpat," what does he do with it?

hebrew_text: כִּדְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: כׇּל תַּעֲנִית שֶׁמְּלִינִין בּוֹ אֶת הַצְּדָקָה – כְּאִילּוּ שׁוֹפֵךְ דָּמִים, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״מְלֵאֲתִי מִשְׁפָּט צֶדֶק וְגוֹ׳״. וְהָנֵי מִילֵּי – בְּרִיפְתָּא וְתַמְרֵי, אֲבָל בְּזוּזֵי, חִיטֵּי וּשְׂעָרֵי – לֵית לַן בַּהּ.
human_translation: in accordance with that Rabbi Elazar Rabbi Yitzḥak says, as Rabbi Elazar says Rabbi Yitzḥak says: Every fast on which the charity [ tzedaka ] is left overnight, as if spilled blood As it is stated: “She that was full of justice [ tzedek ], And this statement with regard to bread and dates, but with regard to money, wheat, and barley, we have no with it.
llm_translation: As Rabbi Elazar said, Rabbi Yitzchak said, as Rabbi Elazar said, Rabbi Yitzchak said: Any fast in which one includes charity is as if they poured out blood, as it is stated: "I am full of righteous judgment." And these matters - with bread and dates, but with nuts, barley, and lentils - we do not have them.

hebrew_text: לְפִיכָךְ אֵין דָּנִין כּוּ׳. מַאי טַעְמָא?
human_translation: Therefore, does not judge What is the reason
llm_translation: Therefore, we do not judge him. What is the reason?

hebrew_text: מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא אֶפְשָׁר. הֵיכִי לֶיעְבַּד? לִידַיְּינֵיהּ בְּמַעֲלֵי שַׁבְּתָא וְלִיגְמְרֵיהּ לְדִינֵיהּ בְּמַעֲלֵי שַׁבְּתָא? דִּילְמָא חָזוּ טַעַם לְחוֹבָה, וּבָעוּ לְמִיעְבַּד הֲלָנַת דִּין. לְדַיְּינֵיהּ בְּמַעֲלֵי שַׁבְּתָא וְלִיגְמְרֵיהּ בְּשַׁבְּתָא, וְלִיקְטְלֵיהּ בְּשַׁבְּתָא? אֵין רְצִיחָה דּוֹחָה אֶת שַׁבָּת. וְלִיקְטְלֵיהּ לְאוּרְתָּא? נֶגֶד הַשֶּׁמֶשׁ בָּעֵינַן.
human_translation: because not possible how should we act? we judge him on Shabbat eve and conclude his verdict on Shabbat eve, perhaps we would see a reason to find liable, and required to perform a suspension of the trial We judge him on Shabbat eve and conclude on Shabbat, and, kill him on Shabbat, murder does not override Shabbat. And We kill him at night, we require facing the sun,
llm_translation: Because it is not possible. How can it be done? To involve himself in the matters of Shabbat and to conclude his judgment on Shabbat? Perhaps they will see a reason for obligation, and they will want to fulfill the judgment immediately. To involve himself in the matters of Shabbat and to conclude his judgment on Shabbat, and to execute him on Shabbat? Murder does not override Shabbat. And to execute him by fire? We require it to be done before sunset.

hebrew_text: וְלִיגְמְרֵיהּ לְדִינֵיהּ בְּשַׁבְּתָא, וְלִיקְטְלֵיהּ בְּחַד בְּשַׁבְּתָא? נִמְצָא אַתָּה מְעַנֶּה אֶת דִּינוֹ. נִידַיְּינֵיהּ בְּמַעֲלֵי שַׁבְּתָא וְנִגְמְרֵיהּ בְּחַד בְּשַׁבְּתָא? מִינְּשׁוּ טַעְמַיְיהוּ. אַף עַל גַּב דִּשְׁנֵי סוֹפְרֵי הַדַּיָּינִין עוֹמְדִים לִפְנֵיהֶם, וְכוֹתְבִין דִּבְרֵי הַמְזַכִּין וְדִבְרֵי הַמְחַיְּיבִין, נְהִי דִּבְפוּמָּא כָּתְבִין, לִיבָּא דְּאִינְּשִׁי אִינְּשִׁי. הִלְכָּךְ לָא אֶפְשָׁר.
human_translation: And We conclude his verdict on Shabbat, and kill him on Sunday, you are found to have caused a delay in his verdict, We judge him on Shabbat eve and conclude on Sunday, forget their reasons And even though two judges’ scribes are standing before them, and they write the statements of those who acquit and the statements of those who find liable, they write that which the mouths the hearts of people [ enashei ] are forgetful [ inshei ], and they will forget the reasons. Therefore, not possible
llm_translation: And to finish his judgment on Shabbat, and to execute him on one Shabbat? You find yourself answering his judgment. We would judge him in the beginning of Shabbat and finish his judgment on one Shabbat? From their reasons. Even though the two scribes of the judges stand before them, and write the words of those who acquit and the words of those who convict, they write with their mouths, the heart of man is man. Therefore, it is not possible.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: וּתְהֵא קְבוּרַת מֵת מִצְוָה דּוֹחָה שַׁבָּת מִקַּל וָחוֹמֶר: וּמָה עֲבוֹדָה שֶׁדּוֹחָה שַׁבָּת – קְבוּרַת מֵת מִצְוָה דּוֹחָה אוֹתָהּ, מִ״וּלְאַחֹתוֹ״.
human_translation: Reish Lakish said to Rabbi Yoḥanan: And the burial of a corpse with no one to bury it [ met mitzva ] should override Shabbat by an a fortiori If service, which overrides Shabbat, the burial of a met mitzva overrides it, based on “Or for his sister”
llm_translation: He said to him Resh Lakish to Rabbi Yochanan: "And let the burial of the dead override the Sabbath by a fortiori reasoning. And what labor overrides the Sabbath - the burial of the dead, which is a commandment, overrides it, from 'his sister'."

hebrew_text: כִּדְתַנְיָא: ״לְאָבִיו וּלְאִמּוֹ לְאָחִיו וּלְאַחֹתוֹ״ – מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר? הֲרֵי שֶׁהָיָה הוֹלֵךְ לִשְׁחוֹט אֶת פִּסְחוֹ וְלָמוּל אֶת בְּנוֹ
human_translation: As it is taught for his father, or for his mother, for his brother, or for his sister, Why the verse state was going to slaughter his Paschal offering or to circumcise his son
llm_translation: As it was taught: "To his father and to his mother, to his brother and to his sister" - what is the Talmud to say? Behold, if he was going to slaughter his Passover offering and to circumcise his son.

hebrew_text: וְשָׁמַע שֶׁמֵּת לוֹ מֵת, יָכוֹל יִטַּמֵּא? אָמַרְתָּ: ״לֹא יִטַּמֵּא״.
human_translation: and he heard that of his died, might he should become ritually impure You said: “He shall not make himself impure”;
llm_translation: "And he heard that his relative died, can he become ritually impure? You said: 'He shall not become impure.'"

hebrew_text: יָכוֹל, כְּשֵׁם שֶׁאֵינוֹ מִטַּמֵּא לַאֲחוֹתוֹ כָּךְ אֵינוֹ מִטַּמֵּא לְמֵת מִצְוָה? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וּלְאַחֹתוֹ״. לַאֲחוֹתוֹ הוּא דְּאֵינוֹ מִטַּמֵּא, אֲבָל מִטַּמֵּא לְמֵת מִצְוָה.
human_translation: might Just as he may not become impure to his sister, so he may not become impure to a met mitzva . the verse states “Or for his sister”; he may not become impure to his sister, but he may become impure to a met mitzva .
llm_translation: I can, as he does not become impure to his sister, so too he does not become impure for a mitzvah? The verse teaches: "And to his sister." It is to his sister that he does not become impure, but he does become impure for a mitzvah.

hebrew_text: שַׁבָּת שֶׁנִּידְחֵת מִפְּנֵי עֲבוֹדָה, אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁתְּהֵא קְבוּרַת מֵת מִצְוָה דּוֹחָה אוֹתָהּ?
human_translation: Shabbat, which is overridden due to service, is it not logical that the burial of a met mitzva overrides it?
llm_translation: Shabbat that was pushed aside because of work, is it not the law that the burial of the dead overrides it?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: רְצִיחָה תּוֹכִיחַ, שֶׁדּוֹחָה אֶת הָעֲבוֹדָה וְאֵינָהּ דּוֹחָה אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת.
human_translation: said to him: murder, proves as overrides service, but it does not override Shabbat.
llm_translation: He said to him: Murder proves, for it overrides the service but does not override the Sabbath.

hebrew_text: רְצִיחָה גּוּפָהּ תִּדְחֶה אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת מִקַּל וָחוֹמֶר: מָה עֲבוֹדָה שֶׁדּוֹחֶה אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת, רְצִיחָה דּוֹחָה אוֹתָהּ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״מֵעִם מִזְבְּחִי תִּקָּחֶנּוּ לָמוּת״; שַׁבָּת שֶׁנִּידְחֵת מִפְּנֵי עֲבוֹדָה, אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁתְּהֵא רְצִיחָה דּוֹחָה אוֹתָהּ?
human_translation: Murder itself should override Shabbat based on a fortiori Just as service, which overrides Shabbat, murder overrides it, as it is stated: you shall take him from My altar, that he may die” Shabbat, which is overridden due to service, is it not logical that murder should override it?
llm_translation: The murder of her body pushes aside the Sabbath from a fortiori reasoning: Just as labor that pushes aside the Sabbath, murder pushes it aside, as it is stated, "You shall take him from upon My altar to die"; a Sabbath that is set aside because of labor, is it not logical that murder should push it aside?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: כְּבָר פַּסְקַהּ תָּנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל, דְּתָנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: ״לֹא תְבַעֲרוּ אֵשׁ״ – מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר?
human_translation: Rava said It has already been ruled by a tanna of the school of Rabbi Yishmael, as the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: What the verse states: “You shall kindle no fire
llm_translation: Rava said: Already has ruled the Tanna of the school of Rabbi Yishmael, as it was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael: "Do not kindle a fire" - what is the teaching to say?

hebrew_text: מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר? אִי לְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי – לְלָאו יָצָאת, אִי לְרַבִּי נָתָן – לְחַלֵּק יָצָאת. כִּדְתַנְיָא: הַבְעָרָה לְלָאו יָצָאת, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי. רַבִּי נָתָן אוֹמֵר: לְחַלֵּק יָצָאת.
human_translation: What the verse states If in accordance with Rabbi Yosei, was singled out to prohibition, If in accordance with Rabbi Natan, was singled out to divide As it is taught Kindling of fire was singled out to prohibition, the statement of Rabbi Yosei. Rabbi Natan says: It was singled out to divide
llm_translation: What is the Talmud saying? If according to Rabbi Yosei – you have not fulfilled the obligation, if according to Rabbi Natan – you have fulfilled the obligation. As it was taught: Regarding burning the forbidden mixture, you have not fulfilled the obligation, these are the words of Rabbi Yosei. Rabbi Natan says: You have fulfilled the obligation.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: תְּנָא ״מוֹשָׁבוֹת״ קַשְׁיָא לֵיהּ. ״מוֹשָׁבוֹת״ – מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר? מִכְּדֵי שַׁבָּת חוֹבַת הַגּוּף הִיא, וְחוֹבַת הַגּוּף נוֹהֶגֶת בֵּין בְּאָרֶץ בֵּין בְּחוּץ לָאָרֶץ. ״מוֹשָׁבוֹת״ דִּכְתַב רַחֲמָנָא לְמָה לִי?
human_translation: Rather, Rava said: “habitations” difficulty for tanna : What the verse states: habitations After all, Shabbat is an obligation on the himself, And an obligation on the himself is practiced whether in Eretz or outside of Eretz Why do I “habitations” that the Merciful One writes
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said: The Tanna taught, "dwellings" is difficult for him. What does "dwellings" come to teach? Because sitting on Shabbat is an obligation of the body, and the obligation of the body applies whether inside the land or outside the land. "Dwellings" that the Merciful One wrote, why do I need it?

hebrew_text: מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל אָמַר תַּלְמִיד אֶחָד: לְפִי שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״כִּי יִהְיֶה בְאִישׁ חֵטְא מִשְׁפַּט מָוֶת וְהוּמָת״, שׁוֹמֵעַ אֲנִי בֵּין בַּחוֹל בֵּין בַּשַּׁבָּת. וְהָא מָה אֲנִי מְקַיֵּים ״מְחַלְּלֶיהָ מוֹת יוּמָת״? בִּשְׁאָר מְלָאכוֹת, חוּץ מִמִּיתַת בֵּית דִּין. אוֹ אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ מִיתַת בֵּית דִּין? וּמָה אֲנִי מְקַיֵּים ״וְהוּמָת״? בְּחוֹל אֲבָל לֹא בְּשַׁבָּת. אוֹ אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ בַּשַּׁבָּת?
human_translation: One student said in the name of Rabbi Yishmael since it is stated: if there is in a man a sin deserving of death and he is put to death” I derive both during the week and on Shabbat. And how do I realize “Everyone that desecrates it shall be put to death” to other labor excludes the death a court, Or rather, even the death a court And how do I realize “And he is put to death”? on weekdays, but not on Shabbat. Or rather, even on Shabbat.
llm_translation: From the teaching of Rabbi Yishmael, a certain disciple said: Because it is stated, "If there is a judgment of death upon a person, and he shall die," I hear this whether on a weekday or on Shabbat. And what am I fulfilling "He shall surely be put to death" by violating Shabbat? In all other labors, except for the execution by the court. Or is it applicable even to the execution by the court? And what am I fulfilling "and he shall die"? On a weekday but not on Shabbat. Or is it applicable even on Shabbat?

hebrew_text: תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״לֹא תְבַעֲרוּ אֵשׁ בְּכֹל מֹשְׁבֹתֵיכֶם״, וּלְהַלָּן הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״וְהָיוּ אֵלֶּה לָכֶם לְחֻקַּת מִשְׁפָּט לְדֹרֹתֵיכֶם בְּכֹל מוֹשְׁבֹתֵיכֶם״. מָה ״מוֹשָׁבוֹת״ הָאָמוּר לְהַלָּן – בֵּית דִּין, אַף ״מוֹשָׁבוֹת״ הָאָמוּר כָּאן – בֵּית דִּין. וְאָמַר רַחֲמָנָא: ״לֹא תְבַעֲרוּ אֵשׁ בְּכֹל מֹשְׁבֹתֵיכֶם״.
human_translation: the verse states: “You shall kindle no fire throughout your habitations and there, states: “And these shall be for you a statute of judgment throughout your generations in all your habitations” Just as “habitations” that is stated there a court, so too “habitations” that is stated here a court. And the Merciful One states: “You shall kindle no fire throughout your habitations.”
llm_translation: The Talmud teaches: "Do not kindle a fire in all your dwellings," and elsewhere it says: "And these shall be to you a statute of judgment for your generations in all your dwellings." Just as "dwellings" mentioned there refers to the court, so too "dwellings" mentioned here refers to the court. And the Merciful One said: "Do not kindle a fire in all your dwellings."

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: הַשְׁתָּא דְּאָמְרַתְּ אֵין רְצִיחָה דּוֹחָה אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת, אֵין רְצִיחָה דּוֹחָה אֶת הָעֲבוֹדָה מִקַּל וָחוֹמֶר. וּמָה שַׁבָּת שֶׁנִּידְחֵית מִפְּנֵי הָעֲבוֹדָה – אֵין רְצִיחָה דּוֹחָה אוֹתָהּ, עֲבוֹדָה שֶׁהִיא דּוֹחָה אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת – אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁלֹּא תְּהֵא רְצִיחָה דּוֹחָה אוֹתָהּ?
human_translation: Abaye says: Now that you have said murder does not override Shabbat, murder does not override the service based on an a fortiori And just as Shabbat, which is overridden for the service, murder does not override it, service, which overrides Shabbat, is it not logical that murder should not override it?
llm_translation: Abaye said: Now that you say that murder overrides the Sabbath, murder overrides work a fortiori. And just as the Sabbath that was set aside because of work - murder does not override it, work that overrides the Sabbath - is it not logical that murder should override it?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, הָא דִּכְתִיב: ״מֵעִם מִזְבְּחִי תִּקָּחֶנּוּ לָמוּת״? הָהוּא לְקׇרְבַּן יָחִיד, דְּלָא דָּחֵי שַׁבָּת.
human_translation: But that which is written “You shall take him from My altar, that he may die” That concerning an offering of an individual, which does not override Shabbat.
llm_translation: Rather, this that is written: "From my altar you shall take it to die"? That refers to an individual offering, which does not override the Sabbath.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: אִי הָכִי, לָא תְּהֵא רְצִיחָה דּוֹחָה קׇרְבַּן יָחִיד מִקַּל וָחוֹמֶר:
human_translation: Rava says: If that is so, murder should not override an offering of an individual based on an a fortiori
llm_translation: Rava said: If so, there should not be murder that overrides a private offering from a fortiori reasoning.

hebrew_text: מָה יוֹם טוֹב שֶׁנִּדְחֶה מִפְּנֵי קׇרְבַּן יָחִיד, אֵין רְצִיחָה דּוֹחָה אוֹתוֹ. קׇרְבַּן יָחִיד שֶׁהוּא דּוֹחֶה אֶת יוֹם טוֹב, אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁלֹּא תְּהֵא רְצִיחָה דּוֹחָה אוֹתוֹ?
human_translation: Just as a Festival, which is overridden due to an offering of an individual, murder does not override it, an offering of an individual, which overrides a Festival, is it not logical that murder should not override it?
llm_translation: What is a festival that is postponed because of an individual offering, its prohibition does not override it. An individual offering that overrides a festival, is it not logical that its prohibition should not override it?

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר אֵין נְדָרִים וּנְדָבוֹת קְרֵיבִין בְּיוֹם טוֹב, אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר נְדָרִים וּנְדָבוֹת קְרֵיבִין בְּיוֹם טוֹב – מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר?
human_translation: This works out well according to the one who says vow and gift are not sacrificed on a Festival. But according to the one who says vow and gift are sacrificed on a Festival, what is there to say?
llm_translation: He left it for the one who says vows and freewill offerings are brought on a festival day, rather than for the one who says vows and freewill offerings are not brought on a festival day - what can be said in response?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: לָא מִיבַּעְיָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר נְדָרִים וּנְדָבוֹת קְרֵיבִין בְּיוֹם טוֹב, דְּהָא לָא מִתְקַיֵּים ״מֵעִם מִזְבְּחִי״ כְּלָל.
human_translation: Rather, Rava says not necessary according to the one who says vow and gift are sacrificed on a Festival, as cannot justify “from My altar” at all,
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said: It is not necessary according to the one who says that vows and voluntary offerings are brought on a festival day, for the verse "from my altar" is not fulfilled in general.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ לְמַאן דְּאָמַר: נְדָרִים וּנְדָבוֹת אֵין קְרֵיבִין בְּיוֹם טוֹב, הָכְתִיב ״מֵעִם מִזְבְּחִי״ – מִזְבְּחִי הַמְיוּחָד לִי, וּמַאי נִינְהוּ? תָּמִיד. וְאָמַר רַחֲמָנָא: ״מֵעִם מִזְבְּחִי תִּקָּחֶנּוּ לָמוּת״.
human_translation: But even according to the one who says vow and gift are not sacrificed on a Festival, But isn’t it written: “From My altar”? My altar, that is designated to Me. And what is this? the daily offering. And the Merciful One states: “You shall take him from My altar, that he may die.”
llm_translation: Rather, even according to the one who says: Vows and freewill offerings are not brought on a festival, it is written, "from My altar" - from My designated altar, and what are they? The daily offerings. And the Merciful One said: "from My altar you shall take it to die."

hebrew_text: דִּינֵי מָמוֹנוֹת, הַטְּמָאוֹת וְהַטְּהָרוֹת כּוּ׳. אָמַר רַב: אֲנָא הֲוַאי בְּמִנְיָנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי, וּמִינַּאי דִּידִי הֲווֹ מַתְחֲלִי בְּרֵישָׁא. וְהָא אֲנַן ״מַתְחִילִין מִן הַגָּדוֹל״ תְּנַן!
human_translation: monetary law, the ritual impurity and purity, Rav says: I was among the quorum of judges in the school of Rabbi and they would commence from me, first But we learned commence from the greatest
llm_translation: Monetary laws, the impure and the pure, etc. Rav said: I was among the students of the school of Rabbi, and our practice was to begin with the first Mishnah. But we have learned, "We begin with the greater one!"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה בְּרֵיהּ דְּרָבָא, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַבִּי הִלֵּל בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי וָולֶס: שָׁאנֵי מִנְיָינָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי, דְּכוּלְּהוּ מִנְיָנַיְיהוּ מִן הַצַּד הֲווֹ מַתְחֲלִי.
human_translation: Rabba, son of Rava, says, and some say Rabbi Hillel, son of Rabbi Valles, The counting in the school of Rabbi is different, as all of their counting would commence from the side
llm_translation: Rabba, son of Rava, said, and some say it was Rabbi Hillel, son of Rabbi Wolles: The counting of the house of Rabbi was all counted from the side, they would begin.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבָּה בְּרֵיהּ דְּרָבָא, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַבִּי הִלֵּל בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי וָולֶס: מִימוֹת מֹשֶׁה וְעַד רַבִּי לֹא מָצִינוּ תּוֹרָה וּגְדוּלָּה בְּמָקוֹם אֶחָד.
human_translation: And Rabba, son of Rava, says, and some say Rabbi Hillel, son of Rabbi Valles, From the days of Moses and until Rabbi we do not find Torah and greatness in one place,
llm_translation: And Rabba, son of Rava, said, and it was stated: Rabbi Hillel, son of Rabbi Wolles, said: From the days of Moses until Rabbi, we did not find Torah and greatness in one place.

hebrew_text: וְלָא? הָא הֲוָה יְהוֹשֻׁעַ! הֲוָה אֶלְעָזָר. וְהָא הֲוָה פִּנְחָס! הֲווֹ זְקֵנִים.
human_translation: But not Wasn’t there Joshua, there was Elazar, But wasn’t there Pinehas, There were the Elders,
llm_translation: And not? Wasn't it Joshua! It was Eleazar. And wasn't it Phinehas! They were elders.

hebrew_text: וְהָא הֲוָה שָׁאוּל! הֲוָה שְׁמוּאֵל. וְהָא נָח נַפְשֵׁיהּ! כּוּלְּהוּ שְׁנֵיהּ קָאָמְרִינַן.
human_translation: But wasn’t there Saul, There was Samuel, But didn’t die We say all the years
llm_translation: And this was Saul! His name was Samuel. And this was a rest for his soul! All of them said.

hebrew_text: וְהָא הֲוָה דָּוִד! הֲוָה עִירָא הַיָּאִירִי. וְהָא נָח נַפְשֵׁיהּ! כּוּלְּהוּ שְׁנֵיהּ קָאָמְרִינַן.
human_translation: But wasn’t there David, There was Ira the Yairite, But didn’t die We say all the years
llm_translation: And this was David! It was Ira the Jairite. And he rested his soul! All of them were saying both of them.

hebrew_text: וְהָא הֲוָה שְׁלֹמֹה! הֲוָה שִׁמְעִי בֶּן גֵּרָא. וְהָא קַטְלֵיהּ! כּוּלֵּיהּ שְׁנֵיהּ קָאָמְרִינַן.
human_translation: But wasn’t there Solomon, there was Shimi ben Gera, But didn’t kill him We say all the years
llm_translation: And this was Shlomo! Shimei ben Gera was. And this killed him! All of him we say.

hebrew_text: הָא הֲוָה חִזְקִיָּה! הֲוָה שֶׁבְנָא. וְהָא אִיקְּטִיל! כּוּלְּהוּ שְׁנֵיהּ קָאָמְרִינַן. וְהָא הֲוָה עֶזְרָא! הֲוָה נְחֶמְיָה בֶּן חֲכַלְיָה.
human_translation: Wasn’t there Hezekiah, There was Shebnah But wasn’t he killed We say all the years But wasn’t there Ezra, There was Nehemiah, son of Hacaliah,
llm_translation: Here was Hezekiah! Was the son. And here he overturned! All of them both were saying. And here was Ezra! Was Nehemiah son of Hacaliah.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה: אַף אֲנִי אוֹמֵר, מִימוֹת רַבִּי עַד רַב אָשֵׁי לֹא מָצִינוּ תּוֹרָה וּגְדוּלָּה בְּמָקוֹם אֶחָד. וְלָא? וְהָא הֲוָה הוּנָא בַּר נָתָן! הוּנָא בַּר נָתָן מִיכָּף הֲוָה כַּיִיף לֵיהּ לְרַב אָשֵׁי.
human_translation: Rav Adda bar Ahava says: I also say from the days of Rabbi and until Rav Ashi we do not find Torah and greatness in one place, But not But wasn’t there Huna bar Natan, Huna bar Natan was subordinate to Rav Ashi,
llm_translation: Rav Adda bar Ahava said: I also say, from the days of Rabbi until Rav Ashi, we did not find Torah and greatness in one place. Is it not so? But was there not Huna bar Natan! Huna bar Natan was as pleasant to Rav Ashi as a jester.

hebrew_text: דִּינֵי נְפָשׁוֹת מַתְחִילִין מִן הַצַּד. מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? אָמַר רַב אַחָא בַּר פָּפָּא: אָמַר קְרָא, ״לֹא תַעֲנֶה עַל רִב״. לֹא תַעֲנֶה עַל רַב.
human_translation: capital law, commence from the side From where are these matters Rav Aḥa bar Pappa says: The verse states: “Neither shall you answer in a cause [ al riv ]” Neither shall you answer after Master [ al rav ],
llm_translation: Talmudic text: The laws of capital cases begin from the side. From where do we derive these matters? Rav Acha bar Papa said: The verse states, "Do not answer a fool." Do not answer a fool. English translation: The laws of capital cases begin from the side. From where do we derive these matters? Rav Acha bar Papa said: The verse states, "Do not answer a fool." Do not answer a fool.

hebrew_text: רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, מֵהָכָא: ״וַיֹּאמֶר דָּוִד לַאֲנָשָׁיו חִגְרוּ אִישׁ [אֶת] חַרְבּוֹ וַיַּחְגְּרוּ אִישׁ [אֶת] חַרְבּוֹ וַיַּחְגֹּר גַּם דָּוִד אֶת חַרְבּוֹ״.
human_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana Rabbi Yoḥanan says: from here: “And David said to his men: Every man gird his sword. And every man girded his sword, and David also girded his sword”
llm_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan, from here: "And David said to his men, 'Each man gird on his sword.' And each man girded on his sword, and David also girded on his sword."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב: שׁוֹנֶה אָדָם לְתַלְמִידוֹ, וְדָן עִמּוֹ בְּדִינֵי נְפָשׁוֹת. מֵיתִיבִי: הַטְּהָרוֹת וְהַטְּמָאוֹת, הָאָב וּבְנוֹ, הָרַב וְתַלְמִידוֹ – מוֹנִין לָהֶם שְׁנַיִם. דִּינֵי מָמוֹנוֹת וְדִינֵי נְפָשׁוֹת וְדִינֵי מַכּוֹת, קִידּוּשׁ הַחֹדֶשׁ וְעִיבּוּר שָׁנָה – אָב וּבְנוֹ, הָרַב וְתַלְמִידוֹ, אֵין מוֹנִין לָהֶן אֶלָּא אֶחָד.
human_translation: Rav says: A person may teach his student and judge capital law with him, raises an objection ritual purity and impurity, a father and his son, a teacher and his student, counts them two monetary law and capital law, and laws of lashes, sanctification of the month and the intercalation of the year, a father and his son, a teacher and his student, counts them only one
llm_translation: Rav said: A person should review with his student, and judge with him in matters of life. The questioner objects: Pure and impure, father and son, master and student - they count as two. Laws of monetary matters, laws of life, and laws of lashes, sanctification of the new moon and intercalation of the year - father and son, master and student, they only count as one.

hebrew_text: כִּי קָאָמַר רַב, כְּגוֹן רַב כָּהֲנָא וְרַב אַסִּי, דְּלִגְמָרֵיהּ דְּרַב הֲווֹ צְרִיכִי, וְלִסְבָרֵיהּ דְּרַב לָא הֲווֹ צְרִיכִי.
human_translation: When Rav says such as Rav Kahana and Rav Asi, who needed the traditions of Rav, but they did not need the reasoning of Rav,
llm_translation: When Rav said, for example, like Rav Kahana and Rav Asi, who were disciples of Rav, they needed it, but according to the opinion of Rav, they did not need it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: עֲשָׂרָה דְּבָרִים יֵשׁ בֵּין דִּינֵי מָמוֹנוֹת לְדִינֵי נְפָשׁוֹת, וְכוּלָּן אֵין נוֹהֲגִין בְּשׁוֹר הַנִּסְקָל, חוּץ מֵעֶשְׂרִים וּשְׁלֹשָׁה.
human_translation: Rabbi Abbahu says: There are ten ways monetary law different from capital law, and none of them is practiced with regard to an ox that is stoned, except for twenty-three
llm_translation: Rabbi Avahu said: Ten things there are between laws of monetary matters to laws of life, and all of them are not practiced in the case of an ox that is stoned, except for twenty-three.

hebrew_text: מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? אָמַר רַב אַחָא בַּר פָּפָּא: דְּאָמַר קְרָא ״לֹא תַטֶּה מִשְׁפַּט אֶבְיֹנְךָ בְּרִיבוֹ״. מִשְׁפַּט אֶבְיוֹנְךָ אִי אַתָּה מַטֶּה, אֲבָל אַתָּה מַטֶּה מִשְׁפָּט שֶׁל שׁוֹר הַנִּסְקָל.
human_translation: From where are these matters Rav Aḥa bar Pappa says: As the verse states: “You shall not incline the judgment of your poor in his cause” You may not incline the judgment of, your poor, but you may incline the judgment of an ox that is stoned.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "What are these words?" Rav Acha bar Papa said: As the verse states, 'Do not pervert the justice due to your poor in their lawsuit.' If you pervert the justice due to your poor, you are perverting, but you are perverting the justice of an ox that is to be stoned." English translation:

hebrew_text: עֲשָׂרָה? הָא תִּשְׁעָה הָווּ! הָא עֲשָׂרָה קָתָנֵי! מִשּׁוּם דְּאֵין הַכֹּל כְּשֵׁרִין, וְעֶשְׂרִים וּשְׁלֹשָׁה – חֲדָא הִיא.
human_translation: ten There are nine But teaches ten because not all are fit and twenty-three are one.
llm_translation: Ten? But there were nine! But ten are mentioned! Because not everyone is qualified, and twenty-three - it is one.

hebrew_text: הָא אִיכָּא אַחֲרִיתִי, דְּתַנְיָא: אֵין מוֹשִׁיבִין בְּסַנְהֶדְרִין זָקֵן וְסָרִיס וּמִי שֶׁאֵין לוֹ בָּנִים. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה מוֹסִיף: אַף אַכְזָרִי. וְחִילּוּפֵיהֶן בְּמֵסִית, דְּרַחֲמָנָא אָמַר: ״לֹא תַחְמֹל וְלֹא תְכַסֶּה עָלָיו״.
human_translation: But there is another as it is taught does not seat on the Sanhedrin old person or one who is castrated or one who has no children, Rabbi Yehuda adds: Even a cruel person And the opposite of this with regard to one who entices as the Merciful One states “Neither shall you spare, neither shall you conceal him”
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: Here there is a later teaching: They do not seat in the Sanhedrin an elder, a eunuch, or one who has no children. Rabbi Yehuda adds: Also a cruel person. And their exchange is with a seducer, as the Merciful One said: "You shall not have compassion, nor cover for him."

hebrew_text: הַכֹּל כְּשֵׁרִין לָדוּן דִּינֵי מָמוֹנוֹת. הַכֹּל לְאֵתוֹיֵי מַאי? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: לְאֵתוֹיֵי מַמְזֵר.
human_translation: all are fit to judge monetary law. What is added all? Rav Yehuda says: to include a child born from an incestuous or adulterous relationship [ mamzer ]
llm_translation: All are fit to judge monetary cases. All for what purpose? Rav Yehudah said: To judge mamzerim.

hebrew_text: הָא תְּנֵינָא חֲדָא זִימְנָא: כׇּל הָרָאוּי לָדוּן דִּינֵי נְפָשׁוֹת רָאוּי לָדוּן דִּינֵי מָמוֹנוֹת, וְיֵשׁ רָאוּי לָדוּן דִּינֵי מָמוֹנוֹת וְאֵין רָאוּי לָדוּן דִּינֵי נְפָשׁוֹת. וְהָוֵינַן בַּהּ: לְאֵתוֹיֵי מַאי? וְאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: לְאֵתוֹיֵי מַמְזֵר. חֲדָא לְאֵתוֹיֵי גֵּר, וַחֲדָא לְאֵתוֹיֵי מַמְזֵר.
human_translation: But we learn one time, All who are fit to judge capital law are fit to judge monetary law, but there are those who are fit to judge monetary law and are not fit to judge capital law. And we discussed it: What is included And Rav Yehuda says: to include a mamzer . One to include a convert, and one to include a mamzer .
llm_translation: We have learned one time: Anyone fit for judgment of matters of life is fit for judgment of monetary matters, and there are those fit for judgment of monetary matters but not fit for judgment of matters of life. And we were in it: to include what? And Rav Yehudah said: to include a mamzer. One to include a convert, and one to include a mamzer.

hebrew_text: וּצְרִיכָא, דְּאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן גֵּר – דְּרָאוּי לָבֹא בַּקָּהָל, אֲבָל מַמְזֵר אֵימָא לָא. וְאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן מַמְזֵר – דְּבָא מִטִּיפָּה כְּשֵׁרָה, אֲבָל גֵּר דְּלֹא בָּא מִטִּיפָּה כְּשֵׁרָה אֵימָא לָא. צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: And necessary, As, if taught us a convert, since fit to enter into the congregation, but a mamzer , say cannot And if taught us a mamzer , as he came from seed unflawed but a convert, who does not come from seed unflawed say cannot necessary.
llm_translation: The matter requires, for if we were to hear about a convert - who is fit to enter the congregation, but a mamzer why not. And if we were to hear about a mamzer - for whom a drop of semen is valid, but a convert who is not from a valid drop, why not. It is necessary.

hebrew_text: וְאֵין הַכֹּל כְּשֵׁרִין לָדוּן דִּינֵי נְפָשׁוֹת. מַאי טַעְמָא? דְּתָנֵי רַב יוֹסֵף: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁבֵּית דִּין מְנוּקִּין בְּצֶדֶק, כָּךְ מְנוּקִּין מִכׇּל מוּם. אָמַר אַמֵּימָר, מַאי קְרָא: ״כֻּלָּךְ יָפָה רַעְיָתִי וּמוּם אֵין בָּךְ״.
human_translation: But not all are fit to judge capital law; What is the reason As Rav Yosef taught: Just as the court is clean in justice, so too, it is clean of any blemish, Ameimar says: What is the verse “You are all fair, my love; and there is no blemish in you”
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "And not all are fit to judge matters of life and death. What is the reason? For Rav Yosef teaches: Just as the court must be clear of any injustice, so too must they be clear of any blemish. Amemar said, what is the verse: 'You are all fair, my love, and there is no blemish in you.'"

hebrew_text: וְדִילְמָא מוּם מַמָּשׁ? אָמַר רַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב: אָמַר קְרָא, ״וְהִתְיַצְּבוּ שָׁם עִמָּךְ״ – עִמָּךְ בְּדוֹמִין לָךְ.
human_translation: But perhaps an actual blemish, Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov says: the verse states “That they may stand there with you” “with you” With similarity to you,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And perhaps an actual blemish? Rav Acha bar Yaakov said: The verse says, 'And they shall stand there with you' - with you in a similar form to you."

hebrew_text: וְדִילְמָא הָתָם מִשּׁוּם שְׁכִינָה? אֶלָּא, אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: אָמַר קְרָא ״וְנָשְׂאוּ אִתָּךְ״ – אִתָּךְ בְּדוֹמִין לָךְ לֶיהֱוֵי.
human_translation: But perhaps there, due to Divine Presence, Rather, Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak says: The verse states: and bear the burden with you” “with you” They shall be similar to you,
llm_translation: Perhaps there, because of the Divine Presence? Rather, Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: The verse says, "And they shall take with you" - with you, similar to you, shall it be.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ סַנְהֶדְרִין הָיְתָה כַּחֲצִי גּוֹרֶן עֲגוּלָּה, כְּדֵי שֶׁיְּהוּ רוֹאִין זֶה אֶת זֶה. וּשְׁנֵי סוֹפְרֵי הַדַּיָּינִין עוֹמְדִים לִפְנֵיהֶם, אֶחָד מִיָּמִין וְאֶחָד מִשְּׂמֹאל, וְכוֹתְבִין דִּבְרֵי מְחַיְּיבִין וְדִבְרֵי מְזַכִּין. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: שְׁלֹשָׁה, אֶחָד כּוֹתֵב דִּבְרֵי הַמְזַכִּין, וְאֶחָד כּוֹתֵב דִּבְרֵי הַמְחַיְּיבִין, וְהַשְּׁלִישִׁי כּוֹתֵב דִּבְרֵי הַמְזַכִּין וְדִבְרֵי הַמְחַיְּיבִין.
human_translation: A Sanhedrin was as half of a circular threshing floor, in order that will see one another And two judges’ scribes stand before one on the right and one on the left, and they write the statements of those who find liable and the statements of those who acquit Rabbi Yehuda says: three One writes the statements of those who acquit one writes the statements of those who find liable, and the third writes the statements of those who acquit and the statements of those who find liable,
llm_translation: It was taught in a Mishnah: The Sanhedrin was like a half-round threshing floor, so that they could see each other. And the two scribes of the judges stand before them, one on the right and one on the left, and write the words of those who acquit and the words of those who convict. Rabbi Yehuda says: Three scribes are needed, one writes the words of those who acquit, and one writes the words of those who convict, and the third writes the words of those who acquit and the words of those who convict.

hebrew_text: וְשָׁלֹשׁ שׁוּרוֹת שֶׁל תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים יוֹשְׁבִין לִפְנֵיהֶן, כׇּל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד מַכִּיר אֶת מְקוֹמוֹ. הוּצְרְכוּ לִסְמוֹךְ – סוֹמְכִין מִן הָרִאשׁוֹנָה. אֶחָד מִן הַשְּׁנִיָּה בָּא לוֹ לָרִאשׁוֹנָה, אֶחָד מִן הַשְּׁלִישִׁית בָּא לוֹ לַשְּׁנִיָּה. בּוֹרְרִים לָהֶן עוֹד אֶחָד מִן הַקָּהָל וּמוֹשִׁיבִין אוֹתוֹ בַּשְּׁלִישִׁית. וְלֹא הָיָה יוֹשֵׁב בִּמְקוֹמוֹ שֶׁל רִאשׁוֹן, אֶלָּא יוֹשֵׁב בְּמָקוֹם הָרָאוּי לוֹ.
human_translation: And three rows of Torah scholars sit before each and every one recognizes his place, must ordain ordains from the first one from the second comes to the first one from the third comes to the second selects another from among the assembled and they seat him in the third And would not sit in the place of the first rather, he sit in the place appropriate for him,
llm_translation: Three rows of Torah scholars sit before them, each one recognizing his place. If they need to lean on each other, they lean on the first row. One from the second row moves up to the first row, one from the third row moves up to the second row. They select another one from the assembly and seat him in the third row. He does not sit in the place of the first, but sits in the place suitable for him.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? אָמַר רַבִּי אַחָא בַּר חֲנִינָא: דְּאָמַר קְרָא ״שׇׁרְרֵךְ אַגַּן הַסַּהַר אַל יֶחְסַר הַמָּזֶג וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: From where are these matters Rabbi Aḥa bar Ḥanina says: As the verse states: “Your navel is like a round goblet, let no mingled wine be wanting;
llm_translation: Gemara: What are these words? Rabbi Ahah bar Hanina said: As the verse states, "Your belly is like a heap of wheat, hedged about with lilies" (Song of Songs 7:3).

hebrew_text: ״שׇׁרְרֵךְ״ – זוֹ סַנְהֶדְרִין. לָמָּה נִקְרָא שְׁמָהּ ״שׇׁרְרֵךְ״? שֶׁהִיא יוֹשֶׁבֶת בְּטִיבּוּרוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם. ״אַגַּן״ – שֶׁהִיא מְגִינָּה עַל כׇּל הָעוֹלָם כּוּלּוֹ. ״הַסַּהַר״ – שֶׁהִיא דּוֹמָה לַסַּהַר.
human_translation: “Your navel”; this Sanhedrin. And why is it called “your navel”? because it sits in the navel of the world, “Goblet [ aggan ]”; that protects [ meginna ] the entire world “Round [ hassahar ]”; that is similar to the moon [ sahar ].
llm_translation: "Sharrek" - this is Sanhedrin. Why is it called by the name "Sharrek"? Because it sits in the middle of the world. "Agan" - it protects the entire world. "Hasahar" - it is similar to the dawn.

hebrew_text: ״אַל יֶחְסַר הַמָּזֶג״ – שֶׁאִם הוּצְרַךְ אֶחָד מֵהֶם לָצֵאת, רוֹאִין: אִם יֵשׁ עֶשְׂרִים וּשְׁלֹשָׁה, כְּנֶגֶד סַנְהֶדְרִי קְטַנָּה – יוֹצֵא, וְאִם לָאו – אֵינוֹ יוֹצֵא.
human_translation: “Let no mingled wine be wanting”; that if one of needed to leave, see: If there are twenty-three corresponding to a lesser Sanhedrin, he may leave, but if not, he may not leave.
llm_translation: "אַל יֶחְסַר הַמָּזֶג" - "Do not lack the mixture" - if one of them needs to go out, we see: if there are twenty-three, corresponding to a small Sanhedrin - he goes out, and if not - he does not go out.

hebrew_text: ״בִּטְנְךָ עֲרֵמַת חִטִּים״ – מָה עֲרֵימַת חִטִּים הַכֹּל נֶהֱנִין מִמֶּנָּה, אַף סַנְהֶדְרִין הַכֹּל נֶהֱנִין מִטַּעֲמֵיהֶן. ״סוּגָה בַּשּׁוֹשַׁנִּים״ – שֶׁאֲפִילּוּ כְּסוּגָה שֶׁל שׁוֹשַׁנִּים לֹא יִפְרְצוּ בָּהֶן פְּרָצוֹת.
human_translation: “your belly is like a heap of wheat” just as a heap of wheat, all derive benefit from it, so too, Sanhedrin, all derive benefit from their explanations “set about with lilies” as they do not breach even a fence of lilies,
llm_translation: "In your belly is a heap of wheat" - What is the heap of wheat that everyone benefits from it, so too the Sanhedrin, everyone benefits from their taste. "Enclosed in lilies" - even a lily enclosure will not burst open.

hebrew_text: וְהַיְינוּ דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ הָהוּא מִינָא לְרַב כָּהֲנָא: אָמְרִיתוּ נִדָּה שְׁרֵי לְיַיחוֹדֵי בַּהֲדֵי גַּבְרָא. אֶפְשָׁר אֵשׁ בִּנְעוֹרֶת וְאֵינָהּ מְהַבְהֶבֶת? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הַתּוֹרָה הֵעִידָה עָלֵינוּ ״סוּגָה בַּשּׁוֹשַׁנִּים״, שֶׁאֲפִילּוּ כְּסוּגָה בַּשּׁוֹשַׁנִּים לֹא יִפְרְצוּ בָּהֶן פְּרָצוֹת.
human_translation: And this is as a certain heretic said to Rav Kahana: You say that is permitted a menstruating woman to seclude herself with a man, possible fire to chips and not blaze said to him: The Torah testifies concerning us “set about with lilies,” as do not breach even a fence of lilies.
llm_translation: And this is what that certain Minna said to Rav Kahana: "You said that a menstruating woman is permitted for marital relations in the presence of her husband. Is it possible that a fire is in the flax and it does not kindle?" He said to him: "The Torah testified about us, 'Enclosed in lilies,' that even if they are enclosed in lilies, they will not burst forth."

hebrew_text: רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר: מֵהָכָא, ״כְּפֶלַח הָרִמּוֹן רַקָּתֵךְ״ – אֲפִילּוּ רֵיקָנִין שֶׁבָּךְ מְלֵאִין מִצְוֹת כְּרִמּוֹן. רַבִּי זֵירָא אָמַר: מֵהָכָא, ״וַיָּרַח אֶת רֵיחַ בְּגָדָיו״. אַל תִּיקְרֵי ״בְּגָדָיו״ אֶלָּא ״בּוֹגְדָיו״.
human_translation: Reish Lakish says from here: “Your temples [ rakkatekh ] are like a pomegranate split open” even the empty [ reikanin ] among you are full of mitzvot as the pomegranate Rabbi Zeira says from here: “And he smelled the smell of his garments, Do not read “his garments [ begadav ]”; rather, His traitors [ bogedav ],
llm_translation: Reish Lakish said: From here, "Like the split pomegranate is your temple." - Even your empty ones are full of mitzvot like a pomegranate. Rabbi Zeira said: From here, "And he smelled the scent of his garments." Do not read "his garments" but "his traitors."

hebrew_text: הָנְהוּ בִּרְיוֹנֵי דַּהֲווֹ בְּשִׁיבָבוּתֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי זֵירָא, דַּהֲוָה מְקָרֵב לְהוּ כִּי הֵיכִי דְּנֶיהְדְּרוּ לְהוּ בִּתְיוּבְתָּא, וַהֲווֹ קָפְדִי רַבָּנַן. כִּי נָח נַפְשֵׁיהּ דְּרַבִּי זֵירָא, אָמְרִי: עַד הָאִידָּנָא הֲוָה חֲרִיכָא קַטִּין שָׁקֵיהּ דַּהֲוָה בָּעֵי עֲלַן רַחֲמֵי, הַשְׁתָּא מַאן בָּעֵי עֲלַן רַחֲמֵי? הַרְהֲרוּ בְּלִבַּיְיהוּ וַעֲבַדוּ תְּשׁוּבָה.
human_translation: certain hooligans [ biryonei ] who were in the neighborhood of Rabbi Zeira. He brought them close, in order to cause them to repent but the Sages disapproved When Rabbi Zeira died, said: Until now, there was the short one with singed legs, who would pray for compassion for us. Who will pray for compassion for us now? They thought in their hearts and repented.
llm_translation: Behold, the sons of the household who were in the old age of Rabbi Zeira, who would bring him close so that they would be honored in his presence, and the sages were displeased. When Rabbi Zeira passed away, they said: Until now, there was a small jug of oil that he would need for mercy, but now who will need mercy for us? Reflect in your hearts and repent.

hebrew_text: שָׁלֹשׁ שׁוּרוֹת כּוּ׳. אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ כִּי נָיְידִי, כּוּלְּהוּ נָיְידִי. וְלֵימָא לְהוּ: עַד הָאִידָּנָא הֲוָה יָתֵיבְנָא בְּרֵישָׁא, הַשְׁתָּא מוֹתְבִיתוּ לִי בְּדַנְבֵי? אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: דְּאָמְרִי לֵיהּ הָכִי, ״הֱוֵי זָנָב לָאֲרָיוֹת וְאַל תְּהִי רֹאשׁ לַשּׁוּעָלִים״.
human_translation: three rows Abaye says: Learn from when they move, they all move. But let say to Until now I was sitting at the head now you are seating me at the tail, Abaye says as can say this to him: Be a tail to the lions and do not be a head to the foxes
llm_translation: Three lines. Abaye said: Hear from it that they are movable, all of them are movable. And let them say to him: Until now we were sitting at the beginning, now you are sitting in judgment over us? Abaye said: Because they say to him thus, "Be the tail to lions and do not be the head to foxes."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ כֵּיצַד מְאַיְּימִין אֶת הָעֵדִים עַל עֵידֵי נְפָשׁוֹת? הָיוּ מַכְנִיסִין אוֹתָן וּמְאַיְּימִין עֲלֵיהֶן: שֶׁמָּא תֹּאמְרוּ מֵאוֹמֶד וּמִשְּׁמוּעָה, עֵד מִפִּי עֵד וּמִפִּי אָדָם נֶאֱמָן, שֶׁמָּא אִי אַתֶּם יוֹדְעִין שֶׁסּוֹפֵנוּ לִבְדּוֹק אֶתְכֶם בִּדְרִישָׁה וּבַחֲקִירָה.
human_translation: How does intimidate the witnesses in testimony for capital law? They would bring in and intimidate them Perhaps you say based on conjecture, or based on a rumor, testimony hearsay, or based on the statement of a trusted person. Perhaps you do not know that ultimately we examine you with inquiry and interrogation,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: How do we intimidate the witnesses in capital cases? They would bring them in and intimidate them, saying: Perhaps you will say it was from conjecture or hearsay, a witness is believed from the mouth of another witness and from the mouth of a person; perhaps you do not know that ultimately we will examine you through questioning and investigation.

hebrew_text: הֱווּ יוֹדְעִין, שֶׁלֹּא כְּדִינֵי מָמוֹנוֹת דִּינֵי נְפָשׁוֹת. דִּינֵי מָמוֹנוֹת – אָדָם נוֹתֵן מָמוֹן וּמִתְכַּפֵּר לוֹ. דִּינֵי נְפָשׁוֹת – דָּמוֹ וְדַם זַרְעִיּוֹתָיו תְּלוּיִין בּוֹ עַד סוֹף הָעוֹלָם.
human_translation: You should know that capital law not like monetary law. monetary law, a person give money and his is atoned capital law, the blood of and the blood of his offspring are ascribed to until eternity.
llm_translation: Be aware, that not like monetary laws are the laws of life. Monetary laws - a person gives money and atones for himself. Laws of life - his blood and the blood of his descendants depend on him until the end of the world.

hebrew_text: שֶׁכֵּן מָצִינוּ בְּקַיִן שֶׁהָרַג אֶת אָחִיו, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״דְּמֵי אָחִיךָ צֹעֲקִים״. אֵינוֹ אוֹמֵר ״דַּם אָחִיךָ״ אֶלָּא ״דְּמֵי אָחִיךָ״ – דָּמוֹ וְדַם זַרְעִיּוֹתָיו. דָּבָר אַחֵר: ״דְּמֵי אָחִיךָ״ – שֶׁהָיָה דָּמוֹ מוּשְׁלָךְ עַל הָעֵצִים וְעַל הָאֲבָנִים.
human_translation: as we found with Cain, who killed his brother, as it is stated your brother’s blood [ demei ] cries does not state: Your brother’s blood [ dam ], but “Your brother’s blood [ demei ],” his blood and the blood of his offspring Alternatively, “your brother’s blood [ demei ],” that his blood splattered on the trees and on the stones.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: So we find with Cain who killed his brother, as it is said: "The bloods of your brother cry out." It does not say "the blood of your brother" but "the bloods of your brother" - his blood and the blood of his descendants. Another explanation: "The bloods of your brother" - that his blood was splattered on the trees and on the stones.

hebrew_text: לְפִיכָךְ נִבְרָא אָדָם יְחִידִי, לְלַמֶּדְךָ שֶׁכׇּל הַמְאַבֵּד נֶפֶשׁ אַחַת מִיִּשְׂרָאֵל, מַעֲלֶה עָלָיו הַכָּתוּב כְּאִילּוּ אִיבֵּד עוֹלָם מָלֵא. וְכׇל הַמְקַיֵּים נֶפֶשׁ אַחַת מִיִּשְׂרָאֵל, מַעֲלֶה עָלָיו הַכָּתוּב כְּאִילּוּ קִיֵּים עוֹלָם מָלֵא.
human_translation: Therefore, Adam was created alone, to teach you that anyone who destroys one soul from the Jewish people, the verse ascribes him as if he destroyed an entire world, And anyone who sustains one soul from the Jewish people, the verse ascribes him as if he sustained an entire world.
llm_translation: Therefore, Adam was created singular, to teach you that whoever destroys one soul from Israel, it is accounted to him as if he had destroyed a whole world. And whoever saves one soul from Israel, it is accounted to him as if he had saved a whole world.

hebrew_text: וּמִפְּנֵי שְׁלוֹם הַבְּרִיּוֹת, שֶׁלֹּא יֹאמַר אָדָם לַחֲבֵירוֹ: ״אַבָּא גָּדוֹל מֵאָבִיךָ״, וְשֶׁלֹּא יְהוּ הַמִּינִים אוֹמְרִים: ״הַרְבֵּה רְשׁוּיוֹת בַּשָּׁמַיִם״.
human_translation: And due to peace among people, so person will not say to another: My father, is greater than your father. And so that the heretics will not say: There are many authorities in Heaven,
llm_translation: And because of the peace of creatures, that a person should not say to his fellow, "My father is greater than your father," and that the heretics should not say, "There are many authorities in heaven."

hebrew_text: וּלְהַגִּיד גְּדוּלָּתוֹ שֶׁל הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא, שֶׁאָדָם טוֹבֵעַ כַּמָּה מַטְבְּעוֹת בְּחוֹתָם אֶחָד – כּוּלָּן דּוֹמִין זֶה לָזֶה, וּמֶלֶךְ מַלְכֵי הַמְּלָכִים הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא טָבַע כׇּל אָדָם בְּחוֹתָמוֹ שֶׁל אָדָם הָרִאשׁוֹן, וְאֵין אֶחָד מֵהֶן דּוֹמֶה לַחֲבֵירוֹ. לְפִיכָךְ כָּל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד חַיָּיב לוֹמַר: בִּשְׁבִילִי נִבְרָא הָעוֹלָם.
human_translation: And to tell of the greatness of the Holy One, Blessed be He, as a person stamps several coins with one seal, they are all similar to each other. But the supreme King of kings, the Holy One, Blessed be He, stamped all people with the seal of Adam the first and not one of them is similar to another. Therefore, each and every person is obligated to say: The world was created for me,
llm_translation: And to declare the greatness of the Holy One, blessed be He, that a person stamps many coins with one seal - all of them resemble one another, but the King of kings, the Holy One, blessed be He, stamped each person with the seal of Adam the first, and not one of them is similar to his fellow. Therefore, each and every one is obligated to say: "For my sake the world was created."

hebrew_text: וְשֶׁמָּא תֹּאמְרוּ:
human_translation: And perhaps you will say:
llm_translation: And perhaps you will say:

hebrew_text: מָה לָנוּ וְלַצָּרָה הַזֹּאת? וַהֲלֹא כְּבָר נֶאֱמַר: ״וְהוּא עֵד אוֹ רָאָה אוֹ יָדָע אִם לוֹא יַגִּיד וְגוֹ׳״. וְשֶׁמָּא תֹּאמְרוּ: מָה לָנוּ לָחוּב בְּדָמוֹ שֶׁל זֶה? וַהֲלֹא כְּבָר נֶאֱמַר: ״בַּאֲבֹד רְשָׁעִים רִנָּה״.
human_translation: Why would we this trouble? But is it not already stated: “And he being a witness, whether he has seen or known, if he does not utter it, And perhaps you will say: Why would we to be responsible for the blood of this But is it not already stated: “When the wicked perish, there is song”
llm_translation: What is it to us and to this trouble? Has it not already been said: "And he is a witness, or has seen, or known, if he does not tell"? And lest you say: What concern is it of ours for the blood of this one? Has it not already been said: "In the destruction of the wicked there is singing"?

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: כֵּיצַד מֵאוֹמֶד? אוֹמֵר לָהֶן: שֶׁמָּא כָּךְ רְאִיתֶם? שֶׁרָץ אַחַר חֲבֵירוֹ לְחוּרְבָּה, וְרַצְתֶּם אַחֲרָיו, וּמְצָאתֶם סַיִיף בְּיָדוֹ וְדָמוֹ מְטַפְטֵף, וְהָרוּג מְפַרְפֵּר. אִם כָּךְ רְאִיתֶם – לֹא רְאִיתֶם כְּלוּם.
human_translation: The Sages taught How does based on conjecture? says to Perhaps you saw pursuing another into a ruin, and you pursued him and found a sword in his hand, dripping blood, and the one killed convulsing. If you saw this, you saw nothing,
llm_translation: The Sages taught: How does one examine witnesses? He says to them: Perhaps you saw it like this? A creeping creature was pursuing its fellow to a pit, and you ran after it, and found a sword in its hand and its blood dripping, and you killed it. If you saw it like this - you saw nothing.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן שָׁטַח: אֶרְאֶה בְּנֶחָמָה אִם לֹא רָאִיתִי אֶחָד שֶׁרָץ אַחַר חֲבֵירוֹ לְחוּרְבָּה, וְרַצְתִּי אַחֲרָיו וְרָאִיתִי סַיִיף בְּיָדוֹ וְדָמוֹ מְטַפְטֵף וְהָרוּג מְפַרְפֵּר. וְאָמַרְתִּי לוֹ: רָשָׁע, מִי הֲרָגוֹ לָזֶה? אוֹ אֲנִי אוֹ אַתָּה. אֲבָל מָה אֶעֱשֶׂה שֶׁאֵין דָּמְךָ מָסוּר בְּיָדִי, שֶׁהֲרֵי אָמְרָה תּוֹרָה ״עַל פִּי שְׁנַיִם עֵדִים יוּמַת הַמֵּת״. הַיּוֹדֵעַ מַחְשָׁבוֹת יִפָּרַע מֵאוֹתוֹ הָאִישׁ שֶׁהָרַג אֶת חֲבֵירוֹ. אָמְרוּ: לֹא זָזוּ מִשָּׁם עַד שֶׁבָּא נָחָשׁ וְהִכִּישׁוֹ וָמֵת.
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Shimon ben Shataḥ said I will see the consolation if I did not see one pursue another into a ruin, and I pursued him and saw a sword in his hand, dripping blood, and the one killed convulsing. And I said to him: Wicked person, who has killed this man? Either you or I. But what can I do, since your blood is not given over to me, as the Torah states: “At the mouth of two witnesses, shall he that is to die be put to death” The One Who knows thoughts shall punish this man who killed another. said: They did not move from there before a snake came and bit the and he died.
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Shimon ben Shatach said: I saw in comfort, if I did not see one that a creeping creature after his fellow to the sword, and I ran after him and saw a sword in his hand and his blood dripping and the killed one convulsing. And I said to him: Wicked one, who killed this one? Either I or you. But what shall I do, for your blood is not in my hands, for the Torah said, "By the mouth of two witnesses shall the one deserving of death be put to death." He who knows thoughts will exact punishment from that man who killed his fellow. They said: They did not move from there until a snake came and bit him, and he died.

hebrew_text: וְהַאי בַּר נָחָשׁ הוּא? וְהָאָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף, וְכֵן תָּנֵי דְּבֵי חִזְקִיָּה: מִיּוֹם שֶׁחָרַב בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁבָּטְלָה סַנְהֶדְרִי, אַרְבַּע מִיתוֹת לֹא בָּטְלוּ. לֹא בָּטְלוּ? וְהָא בָּטְלוּ! אֶלָּא, דִּין אַרְבַּע מִיתוֹת לֹא בָּטְלוּ.
human_translation: But was this fit by a snake? But doesn’t Rav Yosef say, and so the school of Ḥizkiyya taught: From the day that the Temple was destroyed, although the Sanhedrin ceased four capital punishment have not ceased. Have they not ceased? But they have ceased, Rather, the halakha of four capital punishment has not ceased
llm_translation: The son of Nachash, is he? And Rav Yosef said, and so too is taught in the school of Chizkiyah: From the day the Temple was destroyed, even though the Sanhedrin ceased, four death penalties were not nullified. Were they not nullified? Indeed, they were nullified! Rather, the law of the four death penalties was not nullified.

hebrew_text: מִי שֶׁנִּתְחַיֵּיב סְקִילָה – אוֹ נוֹפֵל מִן הַגָּג, אוֹ חַיָּה דּוֹרַסְתּוֹ. מִי שֶׁנִּתְחַיֵּיב שְׂרֵיפָה – אוֹ נוֹפֵל בִּדְלֵיקָה, אוֹ נָחָשׁ מַכִּישׁוֹ. מִי שֶׁנִּתְחַיֵּיב הֲרִיגָה – אוֹ נִמְסָר לַמַּלְכוּת, אוֹ לִיסְטִין בָּאִין עָלָיו. מִי שֶׁנִּתְחַיֵּיב חֶנֶק – אוֹ טוֹבֵעַ בַּנָּהָר, אוֹ מֵת בִּסְרוֹנְכֵי.
