human_translation: one who be liable stoning, either falls from a roof or an animal mauls him one who be liable burning, either falls into a fire or a snake bites him, one who be liable to slaying either is turned over to the authorities or robbers come upon him One who be liable strangling either drowns in a river or dies of diphtheria [ bisronekhi ],
llm_translation: One who is liable for stoning - or falls from the roof, or a wild animal tramples him. One who is liable for burning - or falls into a fire, or a snake bites him. One who is liable for execution - or is handed over to the authorities, or bandits come upon him. One who is liable for strangulation - or drowns in the river, or dies by choking.

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי: הָהוּא חֵטְא אַחֲרִיתִי הֲוָה בֵּיהּ, דְּאָמַר מָר: מִי שֶׁנִּתְחַיֵּיב שְׁתֵּי מִיתוֹת בֵּית דִּין – נִידּוֹן בַּחֲמוּרָה.
human_translation: say That had another sin as the Master says: One who is found liable to two court-imposed capital punishment is sentenced to the harsher
llm_translation: They said: That one had a final sin in him, as the Master said: One who incurs two death penalties from the court - he is judged severely.

hebrew_text: מֵאוֹמֶד וְכוּ׳. בְּדִינֵי נְפָשׁוֹת הוּא דְּלָא אָמְדִינַן, הָא בְּדִינֵי מָמוֹנוֹת אָמְדִינַן. כְּמַאן? כְּרַבִּי אַחָא, דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי אַחָא אוֹמֵר: גָּמָל הָאוֹחֵר בֵּין הַגְּמַלִּים וְנִמְצָא גָּמָל הָרוּג בְּצִידּוֹ – בְּיָדוּעַ שֶׁזֶּה הֲרָגוֹ.
human_translation: based on conjecture. in capital law that we do not conjecture, but in monetary law, we do conjecture. In accordance with whose in accordance with Rabbi Aḥa. As it is taught Rabbi Aḥa says: a rutting camel among camels, and a camel was found killed at its side, it is evident that this killed it,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Me'omed ve'chul. Be'dinei nefashot hu de'lo amdin, ha be'dinei mamonoht amdin. Ke'man? Ke'Rabbi Acha, de'tanya, Rabbi Acha omer: Gamal ha'ocher bein hagmalim ve'nimtza gamal harug be'tzido - be'yadua she'zeh harago." English translation: "He who sets an ambush, etc. In cases of capital law, we do not set an ambush, but in cases of monetary law, we do set an ambush. According to whom? According to Rabbi Acha, as it was taught: Rabbi Acha says: If a late camel is found among the camels, and a slain camel is found beside it - it is known that this one killed it."

hebrew_text: וְלִיטַעְמָיךְ, עֵד מִפִּי עֵד דְּקָתָנֵי בְּדִינֵי נְפָשׁוֹת הוּא דְּלָא אָמְרִינַן, הָא בְּדִינֵי מָמוֹנוֹת אָמְרִינַן? וְהָתְנַן: אִם אָמַר ״הוּא אָמַר לִי שֶׁאֲנִי חַיָּיב לוֹ״, ״אִישׁ פְּלוֹנִי אָמַר לִי שֶׁהוּא חַיָּיב לוֹ״ – לֹא אָמַר כְּלוּם, עַד שֶׁיֹּאמַר ״בְּפָנֵינוּ הוֹדָה לוֹ שֶׁהוּא חַיָּיב לוֹ מָאתַיִם זוּז״.
human_translation: But according to your reasoning, that teaches, testimony hearsay, in capital law that we do not say but in monetary law, we do say But didn’t we learn If said: said to me: that I owe So-and-so said to me that owes has said nothing, unless he says, admitted in our presence to that he owes him two hundred dinars,
llm_translation: And to taste, a witness from the mouth of a witness who is precise in matters of life, that we do not say, "This is in matters of monetary law that we say?" And we learned: If he said, "He said to me that I owe him," "So-and-so said to me that he owes him" - he did not say anything until he says, "In our presence he admitted that he owes him two hundred zuz."

hebrew_text: אַלְמָא, אַף עַל גַּב דִּפְסִילִי בְּדִינֵי מָמוֹנוֹת, אָמְרִינַן לְהוּ בְּדִינֵי נְפָשׁוֹת. הָכָא נָמֵי, אַף עַל גַּב דִּפְסִילִי בְּדִינֵי מָמוֹנוֹת, אָמְרִינַן לְהוּ בְּדִינֵי נְפָשׁוֹת.
human_translation: Evidently, although is invalid in monetary law, we tell in capital law. Here, too, although is invalid in monetary law, we tell in capital law.
llm_translation: The Gemara asks: Is it so that even though idolaters are considered valid in monetary matters, we say to them, "You are valid in matters of life and death"? Here too, even though idolaters are considered valid in monetary matters, we say to them, "You are valid in matters of life and death."

hebrew_text: הֱווּ יוֹדְעִים כּוּ׳. אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי חִיָּיא: מְלַמֵּד שֶׁעָשָׂה קַיִן בְּהֶבֶל אָחִיו חַבּוּרוֹת חַבּוּרוֹת, פְּצִיעוֹת פְּצִיעוֹת, שֶׁלֹּא הָיָה יוֹדֵעַ מֵהֵיכָן נְשָׁמָה יוֹצְאָה, עַד שֶׁהִגִּיעַ לְצַוָּארוֹ.
human_translation: You should know Rav Yehuda, son of Rabbi Ḥiyya, says: teaches that Cain caused multiple wounds multiple injuries to his brother Abel. As did not know from where the soul departs, until he came to his neck
llm_translation: Be knowledgeable. Rav Yehudah, son of Rabbi Chiya, said: It teaches that when Cain killed his brother Abel, his joints were dislocated, his dislocations were dislocated, for he did not know from where the soul departs until it reached his neck.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי חִיָּיא: מִיּוֹם שֶׁפָּתְחָה הָאָרֶץ אֶת פִּיהָ וְקִיבְּלַתּוּ לְדָמוֹ שֶׁל הֶבֶל, שׁוּב לֹא פָּתְחָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״מִכְּנַף הָאָרֶץ זְמִרֹת שָׁמַעְנוּ צְבִי לַצַּדִּיק״ – מִכְּנַף הָאָרֶץ וְלֹא מִפִּי הָאָרֶץ. אֵיתִיבֵיהּ חִזְקִיָּה אָחִיו: ״וַתִּפְתַּח הָאָרֶץ אֶת פִּיהָ״! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לְרָעָה פָּתְחָה, לְטוֹבָה לֹא פָּתְחָה.
human_translation: And Rav Yehuda, son of Rabbi Ḥiyya, says: From the day the earth opened its mouth and received the blood of Abel, has not opened again, as it is stated: “From the corner of the earth have we heard songs: Glory to the righteous” “from the corner of the earth,” but not from the mouth of the earth, Ḥizkiyya, brother, raised an objection to “And the earth opened her mouth said to him: opened for a deleterious did not open for a constructive
llm_translation: And Rav Yehudah, son of Rabbi Chiyya, said: From the day the earth opened its mouth and received the blood of Hevel, it did not close again, as it is stated: "From the wing of the earth we have heard songs, glory to the righteous" - from the wing of the earth and not from the mouth of the earth. Chizkiyah his brother raised an objection to him: "And the earth opened its mouth!" He said to him: It opened for evil, but it did not open for good.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי חִיָּיא: גָּלוּת מְכַפֶּרֶת עָוֹן מֶחֱצָה. מֵעִיקָּרָא כְּתִיב: ״וְהָיִיתִי נָע וְנָד״, וּלְבַסּוֹף כְּתִיב: ״וַיֵּשֶׁב בְּאֶרֶץ נוֹד״.
human_translation: And Rav Yehuda, son of Rabbi Ḥiyya, says: Exile atones half a sin. initially is written “And I shall be a fugitive [ na ] and a wanderer [ vanad ] and ultimately is written: and dwelt in the land of Nod”
llm_translation: And said Rav Yehudah son of Rabbi Chiyya: Exile atones for sin half. Initially it is written: "And I will be restless and wandering," and ultimately it is written: "And he settled in the land of Nod."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: גָּלוּת מְכַפֶּרֶת שְׁלֹשָׁה דְּבָרִים, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כֹּה אָמַר ה׳ וְגוֹ׳ הַיֹּשֵׁב בָּעִיר הַזֹּאת יָמוּת בַּחֶרֶב בָּרָעָב וּבַדָּבֶר וְהַיּוֹצֵא וְנָפַל עַל הַכַּשְׂדִּים הַצָּרִים עֲלֵיכֶם וְחָיָה וְהָיְתָה לּוֹ נַפְשׁוֹ לְשָׁלָל״.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says: Exile atones three matters, as it is stated: “So says the Lord: He that abides in this city shall die by the sword, and by the famine, and by the pestilence; but he that goes out, and falls away to the Chaldeans that besiege you, he shall survive, and his life shall be for him for a prey”
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said: Exile atones for three things, as it is stated: "So said the Lord, 'He who stays in this city shall die by the sword, by famine, and by pestilence, but he who goes out and surrenders to the Chaldeans who besiege you shall live, and his life shall be as booty for him.'"

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: גָּלוּת מְכַפֶּרֶת עַל הַכֹּל, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כֹּה אָמַר ה׳ כִּתְבוּ אֶת הָאִישׁ הַזֶּה עֲרִירִי גֶּבֶר לֹא יִצְלַח בְּיָמָיו כִּי לֹא יִצְלַח מִזַּרְעוֹ אִישׁ יֹשֵׁב עַל כִּסֵּא דָוִד וּמֹשֵׁל עוֹד בִּיהוּדָה״. וּבָתַר דִּגְלָה כְּתִיב: ״וּבְנֵי יְכָנְיָה אַסִּר (בְּנוֹ) שַׁלְתִּיאֵל בְּנוֹ״. אַסִּר – שֶׁעִיבְּרַתּוּ אִמּוֹ בְּבֵית הָאֲסוּרִין. שַׁלְתִּיאֵל – שֶׁשְּׁתָלוֹ אֵל שֶׁלֹּא כְּדֶרֶךְ הַנִּשְׁתָּלִין: גְּמִירִי שֶׁאֵין הָאִשָּׁה מִתְעַבֶּרֶת מְעוּמָּד,
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Exile atones for all as it is stated “So says the Lord: Write you this man childless, a man that shall not prosper in his days; for no man of his seed shall prosper, sitting upon the throne of David, and ruling anymore in Judah” And after was exiled it is written: “And the sons of Jeconiah, the same is Assir, Shealtiel his son” “Assir,” that his mother conceived him in prison. “Shealtiel,” that God planted him in a way atypical of plants [ hanishtalin ], is learned that a woman does not conceive standing
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: Exile atones for everything, as it is stated: "So said the Lord, Write this man childless, a man who will not prosper in his days, for no man of his seed will prosper, sitting on the throne of David and ruling again in Judah." And after it was revealed, it is written: "And the sons of Yechaniah, Assir (his son) and Shealtiel his son." Assir - because his mother conceived him in the prison. Shealtiel - because he asked God for something that was not in the way of those who ask: it is a tradition that a woman does not conceive while standing.

hebrew_text: וְהִיא נִתְעַבְּרָה מְעוּמָּד. דָּבָר אַחֵר: שַׁלְתִּיאֵל – שֶׁנִּשְׁאַל עַל אָלָתוֹ אֵל. זְרוּבָּבֶל – שֶׁנִּזְרַע בְּבָבֶל. וּמָה שְׁמוֹ? נְחֶמְיָה בֶּן חֲכַלְיָה שְׁמוֹ.
human_translation: and conceived standing. Alternatively, “Shealtiel” that God [ El ] requested [ nishal ] of His oath, Zerubbabel [ Zerubavel ], that he was sown [ nizra ], in Babylonia [ Bavel ]. And what his name? Nehemiah, son of Hachaliah, his name.
llm_translation: And she was disgusted from standing. Another explanation: Shaltiel - that he was asked about his oath to God. Zerubbabel - that he was sown in Babylon. And what is his name? His name is Nehemiah son of Hacaliah.

hebrew_text: יְהוּדָה וְחִזְקִיָּה בְּנֵי רַבִּי חִיָּיא הֲווֹ יָתְבִי בִּסְעוּדְתָּא קַמֵּי רַבִּי, וְלָא הֲווֹ קָא אָמְרִי וְלָא מִידֵּי. אֲמַר לְהוּ: אַגְבַּרוּ חַמְרָא אַדַּרְדְּקֵי כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלֵימְרוּ מִילְּתָא. כֵּיוָן דְּאִיבַּסּוּם, פָּתְחוּ וַאֲמַרוּ: אֵין בֶּן דָּוִד בָּא עַד שֶׁיִּכְלוּ שְׁנֵי בָּתֵּי אָבוֹת מִיִּשְׂרָאֵל, וְאֵלּוּ הֵן: רֹאשׁ גּוֹלָה שֶׁבְּבָבֶל וְנָשִׂיא שֶׁבְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְהָיָה לְמִקְדָּשׁ וּלְאֶבֶן נֶגֶף וּלְצוּר מִכְשׁוֹל לִשְׁנֵי בָתֵּי יִשְׂרָאֵל״.
human_translation: Yehuda and Ḥizkiyya, sons of Rabbi Ḥiyya, were sitting at a meal before Rabbi and they were not saying anything. said to Add more wine for the young men, so that they will say something. Once they were inebriated, they loosened and said: The son of David, will not come until two fathers’ houses are destroyed from Israel, And they are the head of the exile who is in Babylonia, and the Nasi who is in Eretz Yisrael, as it is stated “And he shall be for a sanctuary; but for a stone of stumbling and for a rock of offense to both the houses of Israel”
llm_translation: Judah and Hezekiah, sons of Rabbi Hiyya, were sitting at a meal before Rabbi, but they did not say anything. He said to them: "Strengthen the wine, so that they may speak a matter." Once they became intoxicated, they opened and said: "The son of David will not come until the two ruling houses of Israel are consumed, and these are: the head of the exile in Babylon and the prince in the land of Israel, as it is said: 'And he shall be for a sanctuary, but for a stone of stumbling and for a rock of offense to both houses of Israel.'"

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָהֶם: בָּנַיי, קוֹצִים אַתֶּם מְטִילִין לִי בְּעֵינַיי? אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי חִיָּיא: רַבִּי, אַל יֵרַע בְּעֵינֶיךָ. ״יַיִן״ נִיתַּן בְּשִׁבְעִים אוֹתִיּוֹת, וְ״סוֹד״ נִיתַּן בְּשִׁבְעִים אוֹתִיּוֹת. נִכְנַס יַיִן – יָצָא סוֹד.
human_translation: said to them: My children, do you throw thorns in my eyes? Rabbi Ḥiyya said to him: My teacher, do not view in a negative Wine [ yayin ] is given in letters of seventy, and secret [ sod ] is given in letters of seventy, wine enters, secrets emerge.
llm_translation: He said to them: My sons, are you piercing thorns in my eyes? Rabbi Hiyya said to him: Rabbi, may it not be evil in your eyes. "Wine" is given with seventy letters, and "secret" is given with seventy letters. When wine enters, secret departs.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא אָמַר מָר עוּקְבָא, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: דָּרֵשׁ מָרִי בַּר מָר, מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיִּשְׁקֹד ה׳ עַל הָרָעָה וַיְבִיאֶהָ עָלֵינוּ כִּי צַדִּיק ה׳ אֱלֹהֵינוּ״? מִשּׁוּם דְּצַדִּיק ה׳ – ״וַיִּשְׁקֹד ה׳ עַל הָרָעָה וַיְבִיאֶהָ עָלֵינוּ״? אִין, צְדָקָה עָשָׂה הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא עִם יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁהִקְדִּים גָּלוּת צִדְקִיָּהוּ וְעוֹד גָּלוּת יְכׇנְיָה קַיֶּימֶת.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda says Mar Ukva says, and some say Rav Ḥisda says Mari bar Mar taught: What which is written: “And so the Lord has hastened the evil, and brought it upon us; for the Lord our God is righteous because “the Lord is righteous” “the Lord has hastened the evil, and brought it upon us”? Yes, a righteous the Holy One, Blessed be He, performed for the Jewish people by hastening the exile of Zedekiah while the exile of Jeconiah, were still alive,
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda said in the name of Mar Ukva, and some say in the name of Rav Ḥisda: Mar son of Mar inquired, what is the meaning of what is written: "And the Lord watched over the evil and brought it upon us, for the Lord our God is righteous"? Because the Lord is righteous - "And the Lord watched over the evil and brought it upon us"? No, the Holy One, blessed be He, acted with righteousness towards Israel, for He hastened the exile of Zedekiah and the exile of Jehoiachin is still pending.

hebrew_text: דִּכְתִיב בֵּיהּ בְּגָלוּת יְכׇנְיָה: ״הֶחָרָשׁ וְהַמַּסְגֵּר אֶלֶף״. חָרָשׁ – כֵּיוָן שֶׁפּוֹתְחִין, הַכֹּל נַעֲשׂוּ כְּחֵרְשִׁין. מַסְגֵּר – כֵּיוָן שֶׁסּוֹגְרִין בַּהֲלָכָה, שׁוּב אֵין פּוֹתְחִין. וְכַמָּה הָיוּ? אֶלֶף.
human_translation: as it is written concerning the exile of Jeconiah: the craftsmen [ heḥarash ] and the smiths [ vehammasger ] one thousand” “ ḥarash ,” when they open all become as though deaf-mutes, “ masger ,” when they close, the halakha , they do not reopen And how many were One thousand.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: It is written in it regarding the exile of Yekonya: "The craftsman and the smith, a thousand." Craftsman - once they open, everything is done like craftsmen. Smith - once they close with a halacha, they do not open again. And how many were there? A thousand.

hebrew_text: עוּלָּא אָמַר: שֶׁהִקְדִּים שְׁתֵּי שָׁנִים לִ״וְנוֹשַׁנְתֶּם״.
human_translation: Ulla says: that He hastened two years of venoshantem .
llm_translation: Ulla said: "That he preceded two years with 'and you shall be changed.'"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ, ״מְהֵרָה״ דְּמָרֵי עָלְמָא תַּמְנֵי מְאָה וְחַמְשִׁין וְתַרְתֵּין הָווּ.
human_translation: Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov says: Learn from it for the Master of the World, soon 852
llm_translation: Rav Acha bar Yaakov said: Hear from it, "quickly," the days of the world are one hundred and fifty-two.

hebrew_text: לְפִיכָךְ כּוּ׳. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אָדָם יְחִידִי נִבְרָא, וּמִפְּנֵי מָה? שֶׁלֹּא יְהוּ מִינִים אוֹמְרִין ״הַרְבֵּה רְשׁוּיוֹת בַּשָּׁמַיִם״. דָּבָר אַחֵר: מִפְּנֵי הַצַּדִּיקִים וּמִפְּנֵי הָרְשָׁעִים, שֶׁלֹּא יְהוּ הַצַּדִּיקִים אוֹמְרִים ״אָנוּ בְּנֵי צַדִּיק״, וּרְשָׁעִים אוֹמְרִים ״אָנוּ בְּנֵי רָשָׁע״.
human_translation: Therefore, The Sages taught Adam was created alone, and for what So that the heretics will not say: There are many authorities in Heaven, Alternatively, Adam was created alone due to the righteous and due to the wicked. so that the righteous will not say: We are the children of the righteous, and the wicked say: We are the children of the wicked
llm_translation: Therefore, as it is stated: The Rabbis taught: Man was created as an individual, and for what reason? So that heretics should not say, "There are many authorities in heaven." Another explanation: For the sake of the righteous and for the sake of the wicked, so that the righteous should not say, "We are descendants of the righteous," and the wicked should not say, "We are descendants of the wicked."

hebrew_text: דָּבָר אַחֵר: מִפְּנֵי הַמִּשְׁפָּחוֹת, שֶׁלֹּא יְהוּ מִשְׁפָּחוֹת מִתְגָּרוֹת זוֹ בָּזוֹ. וּמָה עַכְשָׁיו שֶׁנִּבְרָא יָחִיד מִתְגָּרוֹת, נִבְרְאוּ שְׁנַיִם – עַל אַחַת כַּמָּה וְכַמָּה! דָּבָר אַחֵר: מִפְּנֵי הַגַּזְלָנִין וּמִפְּנֵי הַחַמְסָנִין. וּמָה עַכְשָׁו שֶׁנִּבְרָא יְחִידִי גּוֹזְלִין וְחוֹמְסִין, נִבְרְאוּ שְׁנַיִם – עַל אַחַת כַּמָּה וְכַמָּה!
human_translation: Alternatively, due to the families, so that the families will not quarrel with each other, And if now that was created alone, quarrel two created all the more so Alternatively, due to the robbers and due to those who take by force And if now that was created alone, rob and take by force two created all the more so
llm_translation: Another explanation: Because of the families, so that one family should not quarrel with another. And now that one individual was created from quarrels, two were created - how much more so! Another explanation: Because of the robbers and because of the oppressors. And now that one individual who steals and oppresses was created, two were created - how much more so!

hebrew_text: וּלְהַגִּיד גְּדוּלָּתוֹ כּוּ׳. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן, לְהַגִּיד גְּדוּלָּתוֹ שֶׁל מֶלֶךְ מַלְכֵי הַמְּלָכִים הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא, שֶׁאָדָם טוֹבֵעַ כַּמָּה מַטְבְּעוֹת בְּחוֹתָם אֶחָד וְכוּלָּן דּוֹמִין זֶה לְזֶה, אֲבָל הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא טוֹבֵעַ כׇּל אָדָם בְּחוֹתָמוֹ שֶׁל אָדָם הָרִאשׁוֹן וְאֵין אֶחָד מֵהֶן דּוֹמֶה לַחֲבֵירוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״תִּתְהַפֵּךְ כְּחֹמֶר חוֹתָם וְיִתְיַצְּבוּ כְּמוֹ לְבוּשׁ״.
human_translation: And to tell of the greatness of The Sages taught to declare the greatness of the supreme King of kings, the Holy One, Blessed be He, as a person stamps several coins with one seal, and they are all similar to each other. But the Holy One, Blessed be He, stamps all people with the seal of Adam the first and not one of them similar to another. As it is stated: “It is changed like clay under the seal and they stand as a garment”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And to declare His greatness, etc." The Rabbis taught: To declare the greatness of the King of kings, the Holy One, blessed be He, for a person stamps many coins with one seal, and all of them are similar to one another. But the Holy One, blessed be He, stamps every person with the seal of the first man, and not one of them is similar to his fellow, as it is stated: "They are turned to clay, like a seal; and they stand as a garment."

hebrew_text: וּמִפְּנֵי מָה אֵין פַּרְצוּפֵיהֶן דּוֹמִין זֶה לָזֶה? שֶׁלֹּא יִרְאֶה אָדָם דִּירָה נָאָה וְאִשָּׁה נָאָה וְיֹאמַר: ״שֶׁלִּי הִיא״. שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְיִמָּנַע מֵרְשָׁעִים אוֹרָם וּזְרוֹעַ רָמָה תִּשָּׁבֵר״.
human_translation: And for what are their faces not similar to one another? that a man will not see a beautiful home or a beautiful woman and say: She is mine. As it is stated “And from the wicked their light is withheld and the high arm shall be broken”
llm_translation: And because of what their faces do not resemble one another? So that a person should not see a beautiful dwelling and a beautiful woman and say, "It is mine." As it is said: "But the light of the wicked shall be put out, and the flame of his fire shall not shine."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, הָיָה רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה דְּבָרִים אָדָם מִשְׁתַּנֶּה מֵחֲבֵירוֹ: בְּקוֹל, בְּמַרְאֶה, וּבְדַעַת. בְּקוֹל וּבְמַרְאֶה – מִשּׁוּם עֶרְוָה, וּבְדַעַת – מִפְּנֵי הַגַּזְלָנִין וְהַחַמְסָנִין.
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Meir would say: person is different from another in three ways: In voice, in appearance, and in thought. in voice and appearance due to a woman forbidden to him, And in thought due to the robbers and those who take by force
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Meir would say: In three things a person differs from his fellow: in voice, in appearance, and in intellect. In voice and in appearance - due to immodesty, and in intellect - because of robbers and oppressors.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אָדָם נִבְרָא בְּעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת, וּמִפְּנֵי מָה? שֶׁלֹּא יְהוּ מִינִים אוֹמְרִים: שׁוּתָּף הָיָה לוֹ לְהַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא בְּמַעֲשֵׂה בְרֵאשִׁית. דָּבָר אַחֵר: שֶׁאִם תָּזוּחַ דַּעְתּוֹ עָלָיו, אוֹמֵר לוֹ: יַתּוּשׁ קְדָמְךָ בְּמַעֲשֵׂה בְרֵאשִׁית. דָּבָר אַחֵר: כְּדֵי שֶׁיִּכָּנֵס לַמִּצְוָה מִיָּד.
human_translation: The Sages taught Adam was created on Shabbat eve And for what So that the heretics will not say the Holy One, Blessed be He, had a partner, in the acts of Creation. Alternatively, that if becomes haughty, say to him: The mosquito preceded you in the acts of Creation, Alternatively, in order that he enter into the mitzva immediately.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: Man was created on Friday afternoon, and for what reason? So that heretics would not say: He had a share in the creation of the Holy One, blessed be He, in the work of Creation. Another explanation: If his mind becomes arrogant, it says to him: The gnat preceded you in the work of Creation. Another explanation: So that he may immediately enter into the commandment.

hebrew_text: דָּבָר אַחֵר: כְּדֵי שֶׁיִּכָּנֵס לַסְּעוּדָה מִיָּד. מָשָׁל לְמֶלֶךְ בָּשָׂר וָדָם שֶׁבְּנָהּ פַּלְטֵרִין וְשִׁיכְלְלָן, וְהִתְקִין סְעוּדָה, וְאַחַר כָּךְ הִכְנִיס אוֹרְחִין. שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״חׇכְמוֹת בָּנְתָה בֵיתָהּ חָצְבָה עַמּוּדֶיהָ שִׁבְעָה. טָבְחָה טִבְחָהּ מָסְכָה יֵינָהּ אַף עָרְכָה שֻׁלְחָנָהּ. שָׁלְחָה נַעֲרֹתֶיהָ תִקְרָא עַל גַּפֵּי מְרֹמֵי קָרֶת.״
human_translation: Alternatively, in order that he enter into a feast immediately, comparable to a king of flesh and blood, who built palaces [ palterin ] and improved them, and prepared a feast and afterward brought in his guests. As it is stated: “Wisdom has built her house, and she has hewn out her seven pillars. She has killed her beasts; she has mingled her wine; she has also furnished her table. She has sent forth her maidens; she calls upon the top of the highest places of the city”
llm_translation: Another explanation: in order to immediately enter the feast. A parable to a king of flesh and blood who built a palace and adorned it, and prepared a feast, and only afterwards invited guests. As it is stated: "Wisdom has built her house, she has hewn out her seven pillars. She has slaughtered her meat, she has mixed her wine, she has also set her table. She has sent out her maidens, she calls from the highest places of the city."

hebrew_text: ״חׇכְמוֹת בָּנְתָה בֵיתָהּ״ – זוֹ מִידָּתוֹ שֶׁל הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא, שֶׁבָּרָא אֶת כָּל הָעוֹלָם כּוּלּוֹ בְּחׇכְמָה. ״חָצְבָה עַמּוּדֶיהָ שִׁבְעָה״ – אֵלּוּ שִׁבְעַת יְמֵי בְּרֵאשִׁית. ״טָבְחָה טִבְחָהּ מָסְכָה יֵינָהּ אַף עָרְכָה שֻׁלְחָנָהּ״ – אֵלּוּ יַמִּים וּנְהָרוֹת וְכׇל צוֹרְכֵי עוֹלָם. ״שָׁלְחָה נַעֲרֹתֶיהָ תִקְרָא״ – זֶה אָדָם וְחַוָּה.
human_translation: “Wisdom has built her house”; this the attribute of the Holy One, Blessed be He, Who created the entire world with wisdom. “She has hewn out her seven pillars”; these the seven days of Creation, “She has killed her beasts; she has mingled her wine; she has also furnished her table”; these the seas and rivers and all the necessities of the world “She has sent forth her maidens; she calls”; this Adam and Eve,
llm_translation: "The wisdom has built her house" - this is the attribute of the Holy One, blessed be He, who created the entire world with wisdom. "She has hewn out her seven pillars" - these are the seven days of creation. "She has slaughtered her slaughter, mixed her wine, and also set her table" - these are the seas, rivers, and all the needs of the world. "She has sent out her maidens, she calls" - this is Adam and Eve.

hebrew_text: ״עַל גַּפֵּי מְרֹמֵי קָרֶת״ – רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה רָמֵי: כְּתִיב ״עַל גַּפֵּי״, וּכְתִיב ״עַל כִּסֵּא״. בַּתְּחִלָּה – עַל גַּפֵּי, וּלְבַסּוֹף – עַל כִּסֵּא.
human_translation: “Upon the top of the highest places of the city.” Rabba bar bar Ḥana raises a contradiction: is written: “Upon the top of and is written on a seat Initially, upon the top and ultimately, on a seat
llm_translation: "Over the heights of the city" - Rabba bar bar Ḥana said: It is written "over the heights," and it is written "over the throne." Initially - over the heights, and ultimately - over the throne.

hebrew_text: ״מִי פֶתִי יָסֻר הֵנָּה חֲסַר לֵב אָמְרָה לּוֹ״. אָמַר הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: מִי פִּיתָּהוּ לָזֶה? אִשָּׁה אָמְרָה לוֹ. דִּכְתִיב: ״נֹאֵף אִשָּׁה חֲסַר לֵב״.
human_translation: “Whoever is thoughtless, let him turn in here; as for him that lacks understanding, she tells him” The Holy One, Blessed be He, said: Who lured this The woman told him as it is written: “He who commits adultery with a woman lacks understanding”
llm_translation: "Whoever is simple, let him turn here; lacking heart, she said to him." The Holy One, blessed be He, said: "Who enticed him to this?" A woman said to him. As it is written: "He who commits adultery lacks heart."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, הָיָה רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: אָדָם הָרִאשׁוֹן מִכׇּל הָעוֹלָם כּוּלּוֹ הוּצְבַּר עֲפָרוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״גׇּלְמִי רָאוּ עֵינֶיךָ״, וּכְתִיב: ״כִּי ה׳ עֵינָיו מְשֹׁטְטוֹת בְּכׇל הָאָרֶץ״. אָמַר רַב אוֹשַׁעְיָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב: אָדָם הָרִאשׁוֹן
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Meir would say: The dust Adam the first was gathered from the entire world, as it is stated: Your eyes did see my unshaped flesh” and is written: “For the eyes of the Lord run to and fro throughout the whole earth” Rav Oshaya says in the name of Rav: Adam the first
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Meir would say: The first man, from all the world, entirely was formed from his dust, as it is stated: "Your eyes saw my unformed substance," and it is written: "For the eyes of the Lord run to and fro throughout the whole earth." Rav Oshaya said in the name of Rav: The first man.

hebrew_text: גּוּפוֹ מִבָּבֶל, וְרֹאשׁוֹ מֵאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל, וְאֵבָרָיו מִשְּׁאָר אֲרָצוֹת. עַגְבוֹתָיו, אָמַר רַב אַחָא: מֵאַקְרָא דְאַגְמָא.
human_translation: his torso from Babylonia, and his head from Eretz Yisrael, and his limbs from the rest of the lands his buttocks, Rav Aḥa says: from Akra De’agma,
llm_translation: His body is from Babylon, and his head is from the land of Israel, and his limbs are from other lands. His fruits, Rav Acha said: from the verse of Agma.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בַּר חֲנִינָא: שְׁתֵּים עֶשְׂרֵה שָׁעוֹת הָוֵי הַיּוֹם. שָׁעָה רִאשׁוֹנָה – הוּצְבַּר עֲפָרוֹ, שְׁנִיָּה – נַעֲשָׂה גּוֹלֶם, שְׁלִישִׁית – נִמְתְּחוּ אֵבָרָיו, רְבִיעִית – נִזְרְקָה בּוֹ נְשָׁמָה, חֲמִישִׁית – עָמַד עַל רַגְלָיו, שִׁשִּׁית – קָרָא שֵׁמוֹת, שְׁבִיעִית – נִזְדַּוְּוגָה לוֹ חַוָּה, שְׁמִינִית – עָלוּ לַמִּטָּה שְׁנַיִם וְיָרְדוּ אַרְבָּעָה, תְּשִׁיעִית – נִצְטַוָּוה שֶׁלֹּא לֶאֱכוֹל מִן הָאִילָן, עֲשִׂירִית – סָרַח, אַחַת עֶשְׂרֵה – נִידּוֹן, שְׁתֵּים עֶשְׂרֵה – נִטְרַד וְהָלַךְ לוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אָדָם בִּיקָר בַּל יָלִין״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan bar Ḥanina says: Daytime is twelve hours first hour his dust was gathered. second, figure was fashioned. third, his limbs were extended. fourth, a soul was cast into him. fifth, he stood on his legs. sixth, he called names seventh, Eve was paired with him. eighth, they arose to the bed two, and descended four, ninth, he was commanded not to eat of the Tree tenth, he sinned. eleventh, he was judged. twelfth, he was expelled and left as it is stated: “But man abides not in honor;
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan bar Chanina said: Twelve hours make up the day. The first hour - his dust was gathered, the second - his form was shaped, the third - his limbs were stretched, the fourth - his soul was blown into him, the fifth - he stood on his feet, the sixth - he called out names, the seventh - a mate was arranged for him, the eighth - he ascended to bed as two and descended as four, the ninth - he was commanded not to eat from the tree, the tenth - he sinned, the eleventh - he was judged, the twelfth - he was troubled and went away, as it is said: "Man in his pomp does not endure."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָמֵי בַּר חָמָא: אֵין חַיָּה רָעָה שׁוֹלֶטֶת בְּאָדָם אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן נִדְמָה לוֹ כִּבְהֵמָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״נִמְשַׁל כַּבְּהֵמוֹת נִדְמוּ״.
human_translation: Rami bar Ḥama says A wild animal does not have power over a person unless seems to like an animal, as it is stated: “He is like the beasts that perish.”
llm_translation: Ramei bar Ḥama said: No evil beast rules over a person unless he appears to him like an animal, as it is stated: "They are compared to beasts, they are like beasts."

hebrew_text: (שָׁעָה, בַּסּוֹף, אֲרַמִּי – סִימָן.) אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁבִּקֵּשׁ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לִבְראוֹת אֶת הָאָדָם, בָּרָא כַּת אַחַת שֶׁל מַלְאֲכֵי הַשָּׁרֵת. אָמַר לָהֶם: רְצוֹנְכֶם נַעֲשֶׂה אָדָם בְּצַלְמֵנוּ? אָמְרוּ לְפָנָיו: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם, מָה מַעֲשָׂיו? אָמַר לָהֶן: כָּךְ וְכָךְ מַעֲשָׂיו.
human_translation: a mnemonic At the time, to the end, Aramaic. Rav Yehuda says Rav says: At the time that the Holy One, Blessed be He, sought to create a person, He created one group of ministering angels. He said to them: you agree, let us fashion a person in our image. said before him: Master of the Universe, what are the actions of said to them: His actions are such and such,
llm_translation: (Sha'ah, basof, Arami - siman.) Amar Rav Yehudah Amar Rav: B'sha'ah shebikesha hakadosh baruch hu livro'ot et ha'adam, bara kat achad shel malachei hasharet. Amar lahem: Retzonchem na'aseh adam betzalmenu? Amru lefanav: Ribono shel olam, mah ma'asav? Amar lahem: Kach v'kach ma'asav.

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ לְפָנָיו: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם, ״מָה אֱנוֹשׁ כִּי תִזְכְּרֶנּוּ וּבֶן אָדָם כִּי תִפְקְדֶנּוּ״? הוֹשִׁיט אֶצְבָּעוֹ קְטַנָּה בֵּינֵיהֶן וּשְׂרָפָם. וְכֵן כַּת שְׁנִיָּה. כַּת שְׁלִישִׁית אָמְרוּ לְפָנָיו: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם, רִאשׁוֹנִים שֶׁאָמְרוּ לְפָנֶיךָ מָה הוֹעִילוּ? כָּל הָעוֹלָם כּוּלּוֹ שֶׁלְּךָ הוּא. כׇּל מָה שֶׁאַתָּה רוֹצֶה לַעֲשׂוֹת בְּעוֹלָמְךָ – עֲשֵׂה.
human_translation: said before him: Master of the Universe: “What is man that You are mindful of him? And the son of man that You think of him?” outstretched His small finger among them and burned them And the same a second group third group said before Him: Master of the Universe, the first who spoke before You, what did they accomplish? The entire world is Yours; whatever You wish to do in Your world, do.
llm_translation: They said before Him: Master of the Universe, "What is man that You should remember him, and the son of man that You should visit him?" He extended His small finger between them and burned them. And similarly, He did a second time. A third time they said before Him: Master of the Universe, the earlier ones who said before You, what did they achieve? The entire world is all Yours. Whatever You wish to do in Your world – do.

hebrew_text: כֵּיוָן שֶׁהִגִּיעַ לְאַנְשֵׁי דּוֹר הַמַּבּוּל וְאַנְשֵׁי דּוֹר הַפְּלַגָּה שֶׁמַּעֲשֵׂיהֶן מְקוּלְקָלִין, אָמְרוּ לְפָנָיו: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם, לֹא יָפֶה אָמְרוּ רִאשׁוֹנִים לְפָנֶיךָ? אָמַר לָהֶן: ״וְעַד זִקְנָה אֲנִי הוּא וְעַד שֵׂיבָה אֲנִי אֶסְבֹּל וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: When arrived at the people of the generation of the flood and the people of the generation of the dispersion, whose actions were ruinous, said before God: Master of the Universe, didn’t the speak appropriately before You, said to them “Even to your old age I am the same; and even to hoar hairs will I suffer you;
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Once he reached the generation of the Flood and the generation of the Dispersion, whose deeds were corrupt, they said before Him: Master of the Universe, is it not proper that the earlier generations be mentioned favorably before You? He said to them: "Even to old age I am He, and to gray hairs I will carry and so forth."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: אָדָם הָרִאשׁוֹן מִסּוֹף הָעוֹלָם וְעַד סוֹפוֹ הָיָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לְמִן הַיּוֹם אֲשֶׁר בָּרָא אֱלֹהִים אָדָם עַל הָאָרֶץ וּלְמִקְצֵה הַשָּׁמַיִם וְעַד קְצֵה הַשָּׁמָיִם״. כֵּיוָן שֶׁסָּרַח, הִנִּיחַ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא יָדוֹ עָלָיו וּמִיעֲטוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אָחוֹר וָקֶדֶם צַרְתָּנִי וַתָּשֶׁת עָלַי כַּפֶּכָה״.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Rav says: Adam the first from one end of the world until the other, as it is stated: “Since the day that God created man upon the earth, and from the one end of heaven unto the other” Once sinned, the Holy One, Blessed be He, placed His hand on him and diminished him, as it is stated: “Behind and before You have created me and laid Your hand upon me”
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: The first man, from the end of the world to its end, was, as it is stated: "From the day that God created man on the earth, and from one end of the heavens to the other end of the heavens." Once he sinned, the Holy One, blessed be He, placed His hand upon him and diminished him, as it is stated: "You have hemmed me in, behind and before, and laid Your hand upon me."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: אָדָם הָרִאשׁוֹן מִן הָאָרֶץ עַד לָרָקִיעַ הָיָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לְמִן הַיּוֹם אֲשֶׁר בָּרָא אֱלֹהִים אָדָם עַל הָאָרֶץ וּלְמִקְצֵה הַשָּׁמַיִם עַד קְצֵה הַשָּׁמָיִם״. כֵּיוָן שֶׁסָּרַח, הִנִּיחַ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא יָדוֹ עָלָיו וּמִיעֲטוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אָחוֹר וָקֶדֶם צַרְתָּנִי וְגוֹ׳״. קָשׁוּ קְרָאֵי אַהֲדָדֵי? אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי חֲדָא מִידָּה הִיא.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar says: Adam the first was from the ground until the firmament, as it is stated: “Since the day that God created man upon the earth, and from the one end of heaven unto the other.” Once sinned, the Holy One, Blessed be He, placed His hand on him and diminished him, as it is stated: “Behind and before You have created me the verses contradict each other. This and that, are one measure,
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: The first man was from the earth to the firmament, as it is stated: "From the day that God created man upon the earth, and from one end of the heavens to the other end of the heavens." Once he sinned, the Holy One, blessed be He, placed His hand upon him and diminished him, as it is stated: "You have hemmed me in, back and front." Are the verses contradictory? Each one is from a different aspect.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: אָדָם הָרִאשׁוֹן בְּלָשׁוֹן אֲרַמִּי סִפֵּר, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְלִי מַה יָּקְרוּ רֵעֶיךָ אֵל״.
human_translation: And Rav Yehuda says Rav says: Adam the first spoke in the language of Aramaic, as it is stated “How weighty also are Your thoughts to me, O God”
llm_translation: And Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: The first man spoke in Aramaic, as it is said: "And what have your friends done to you, O me?"

hebrew_text: וְהַיְינוּ דְּאָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: מַאי דִּכְתִיב ״זֶה סֵפֶר תּוֹלְדֹת אָדָם״? מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהֶרְאָהוּ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא דּוֹר דּוֹר וְדוֹרְשָׁיו, דּוֹר דּוֹר וַחֲכָמָיו. כֵּיוָן שֶׁהִגִּיעַ לְדוֹרוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, שָׂמַח בְּתוֹרָתוֹ וְנִתְעַצֵּב בְּמִיתָתוֹ. אָמַר: ״וְלִי מַה יָּקְרוּ רֵעֶיךָ אֵל״.
human_translation: And this, Reish Lakish says: What which is written: “This is the book of the generations of Adam” teaches that the Holy One, Blessed be He, showed every generation and its interpreters, every generation and its wise ones. When he arrived at the generation of Rabbi Akiva, was gladdened by his Torah, and saddened by his death. He said: “How weighty also are Your thoughts to me, O God,”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And this is what Reish Lakish said: What is the meaning of the verse, "This is the book of the generations of Adam"? It teaches that the Holy One, blessed be He, showed him the generations and their interpreters, generation after generation and its sages. When he reached the generation of Rabbi Akiva, he rejoiced in his Torah and was saddened by his death. He said: "And to me, how precious are Your friends, O God." English translation:

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: אָדָם הָרִאשׁוֹן מִין הָיָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיִּקְרָא ה׳ אֱלֹהִים אֶל הָאָדָם וַיֹּאמֶר לוֹ אַיֶּכָּה״ – אָן נָטָה לִבֶּךָ? רַבִּי יִצְחָק אָמַר: מוֹשֵׁךְ בְּעׇרְלָתוֹ הָיָה. כְּתִיב הָכָא: ״וְהֵמָּה כְּאָדָם עָבְרוּ בְרִית״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם: ״אֶת בְּרִיתִי הֵפַר״.
human_translation: And Rav Yehuda says Rav says: Adam the first was a heretic, as it is stated: “And the Lord called to the man and said to him: Where are you”? where has your heart turned, Rabbi Yitzḥak says: He was drew his foreskin is written here: “And they like men [ adam ] have transgressed the covenant” and is written there: he has broken My covenant”
llm_translation: And Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: Adam the first was a species, as it is stated: "And Hashem God called to the man and said to him, 'Where are you?'" - Where did your heart incline? Rabbi Yitzchak said: He was holding onto his foreskin. It is written here: "And they, like men, transgressed the covenant," and it is written there: "He has broken My covenant."

hebrew_text: רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר: כּוֹפֵר בָּעִיקָּר הָיָה. כְּתִיב הָכָא: ״עָבְרוּ בְרִית״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם: ״אֶת בְּרִיתִי הֵפַר״, וְאָמְרוּ: ״עַל אֲשֶׁר עָזְבוּ אֶת בְּרִית ה׳ אֱלֹהֵי אֲבוֹתָם״.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman says: He was a denier of the fundamental principle is written here: have transgressed the covenant,” and is written there: “He has broken My covenant,” “And then they shall answer: Because they have forsaken the covenant of the Lord their God
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said: He was fundamentally denying. It is written here: "They have violated the covenant," and it is written there: "They have broken My covenant," and they said: "Because they have forsaken the covenant of the Lord, the God of their fathers."

hebrew_text: תְּנַן הָתָם, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: הֱוֵי שָׁקוּד לִלְמוֹד תּוֹרָה, וְדַע מָה שֶׁתָּשִׁיב לָאֶפִּיקוֹרוֹס. אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא אֶפִּיקוֹרוֹס נׇכְרִי, אֲבָל אֶפִּיקוֹרוֹס יִשְׂרָאֵל – כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן דְּפָקַר טְפֵי.
human_translation: We learned there Rabbi Eliezer says: Be persistent to learn Torah, and know what to respond to the heretic [ la’apikoros ]. Rabbi Yoḥanan says: taught only a gentile heretic, but a Jewish heretic, All the more so, he will become more heretical.
llm_translation: We learned there, Rabbi Eliezer says: Be diligent in studying Torah, and know what to answer the heretic. Rabbi Yochanan said: They only said this regarding a non-Jewish heretic, but a Jewish heretic - all the more so that his words are null.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁפָּקְרוּ הַמִּינִים, תְּשׁוּבָתָן בְּצִידָּן. ״נַעֲשֶׂה אָדָם בְּצַלְמֵנוּ״, וְאוֹמֵר: ״וַיִּבְרָא אֱלֹהִים אֶת הָאָדָם בְּצַלְמוֹ״. ״הָבָה נֵרְדָה וְנָבְלָה שָׁם שְׂפָתָם״ – ״וַיֵּרֶד ה׳ לִרְאֹת אֶת הָעִיר וְאֶת הַמִּגְדָּל״. ״כִּי שָׁם נִגְלוּ אֵלָיו הָאֱלֹהִים״ – ״לָאֵל הָעֹנֶה אֹתִי בְּיוֹם צָרָתִי״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Any place where the heretics prove their heresy, the response to their alongside them, “Let us make man in our image” but it states: “And God created man in His image” “Come, let us go down and there confound their language” “And the Lord came down to see the city and the tower” “There God was revealed [ niglu ] to him “To God Who answers [ haoneh ] me in the day of my distress”
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: In every place where the heretics were uprooted, their return is at their side. "Let us make man in our image," and it says: "And God created man in His image." "Come, let us go down and confuse their language there" – "And the Lord came down to see the city and the tower." "For there God revealed Himself to him" – "To the God who answered me on the day of my distress."

hebrew_text: ״כִּי מִי גוֹי גָּדוֹל אֲשֶׁר לוֹ אֱלֹהִים קְרֹבִים אֵלָיו כַּה׳ אֱלֹהֵינוּ בְּכׇל קׇרְאֵנוּ אֵלָיו״. ״וּמִי כְעַמְּךָ כְּיִשְׂרָאֵל גּוֹי אֶחָד בָּאָרֶץ אֲשֶׁר הָלְכוּ אֱלֹהִים לִפְדּוֹת לוֹ לְעָם״. ״עַד דִּי כׇרְסָוָן רְמִיו, וְעַתִּיק יוֹמִין יְתִיב״.
human_translation: “For what nation is there so great that has God so near to them as the Lord our God is whenever we call upon Him?” “And who is like Your people, like Israel, a nation one in the earth, whom God went to redeem unto Himself for a people?” till thrones were placed, and one that was ancient of days did sit”
llm_translation: "Who is a great nation that has God close to them, as the Lord our God whenever we call to Him." "And who is like Your people Israel, a single nation on earth that God went to redeem for Himself as a people." "Until the thrones were set up, and the Ancient of Days took His seat."

hebrew_text: הָנָךְ לְמָה לִי? כִּדְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אֵין הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא עוֹשֶׂה דָּבָר אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן נִמְלָךְ בְּפָמַלְיָא שֶׁל מַעְלָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״בִּגְזֵרַת עִירִין פִּתְגָמָא וּבְמֵאמַר קַדִּישִׁין שְׁאֵלְתָא״.
human_translation: Why do I these in accordance with of Rabbi Yoḥanan, as Rabbi Yoḥanan says: The Holy One, Blessed be He, does not act unless He consults with the entourage of Above, as it is stated: “The matter is by the decree of the watchers, and the sentence by the word of the holy ones”
llm_translation: The text reads: "Why do I need it? Like Rabbi Yochanan, for Rabbi Yochanan said: The Holy One, blessed be He, does not do a thing unless He first takes counsel with the Heavenly Academy, as it is stated, 'By the decree of the watchers is the matter, and the sentence by the word of the holy ones is the demand.'"

hebrew_text: הָתִינַח כּוּלְּהִי, ״עַד דִּי כׇרְסָוָן רְמִיו״ מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר? אֶחָד לוֹ וְאֶחָד לְדָוִד, דְּתַנְיָא: אֶחָד לוֹ וְאֶחָד לְדָוִד, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא. אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: עֲקִיבָא, עַד מָתַי אַתָּה עוֹשֶׂה שְׁכִינָה חוֹל? אֶלָּא אֶחָד לְדִין וְאֶחָד לִצְדָקָה.
human_translation: works out well for all what is there to say till thrones were placed”? One for Him and one for David, as it is taught One for Him and one for David; the statement of Rabbi Akiva. Rabbi Yosei said to him: Akiva! Until when will you desacralize the Divine Presence Rather, one for judgment and one for righteousness.
llm_translation: The entire assembly said, "Until his chair was thrown." What can be said in response? One for him and one for David, as it was taught: One for him and one for David, the words of Rabbi Akiva. Rabbi Yosei said to him: Akiva, how long will you make the Divine Presence profane? Rather, one for judgment and one for righteousness.

hebrew_text: קַבְּלַהּ מִינֵּיהּ אוֹ לָא קַבְּלַהּ מִינֵּיהּ? תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּתַנְיָא: אֶחָד לְדִין וְאֶחָד לִצְדָקָה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא. אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה: עֲקִיבָא, מָה לְךָ אֵצֶל הַגָּדָה? כְּלָךְ אֵצֶל נְגָעִים וְאֹהָלוֹת! אֶלָּא, אֶחָד לְכִסֵּא וְאֶחָד לִשְׁרַפְרַף: כִּסֵּא לֵישֵׁב עָלָיו, שְׁרַפְרַף לַהֲדוֹם רַגְלָיו.
human_translation: accept from or not accept it from him? Come hear as it is taught One for judgment and one for righteousness; the statement of Rabbi Akiva. Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya said to him: Akiva! What are you doing near, aggada ? Go near Nega’im and Oholot , Rather, one for a throne and one for a stool. a throne for God to sit upon, and a stool as His footstool.
llm_translation: Accepted from him or not accepted from him? Come and hear, as it was taught: One for judgment and one for charity, the words of Rabbi Akiva. Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah said to him: Akiva, what do you have to do with Aggadah? Your concern is with plagues and tents! Rather, one for a seat and one for a footstool: a seat to sit on, a footstool to support his feet.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: הַאי מַאן דְּיָדַע לְאַהְדּוֹרֵי לְמִינֵי כְּרַב אִידִית – לַיהְדַּר, וְאִי לָא – לָא לַיהְדַּר. אָמַר הָהוּא מִינָא לְרַב אִידִית, כְּתִיב: ״וְאֶל מֹשֶׁה אָמַר עֲלֵה אֶל ה׳״. ״עֲלֵה אֵלַי״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: זֶהוּ מְטַטְרוֹן שֶׁשְּׁמוֹ כְּשֵׁם רַבּוֹ, דִּכְתִיב ״כִּי שְׁמִי בְּקִרְבּוֹ״.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman says: This one, who knows to respond to the heretics as Rav Idit should respond but if not should not respond A certain heretic said to Rav Idit: is written “And to Moses He said: Come up to the Lord” It should have Come up to Me. said to him: This is Metatron, whose name is like the name of his Master, as it is written: for My name is in him”
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said: One who knows how to respond to heretics like Rav Idit - let her respond, and if not - let her not respond. That certain heretic said to Rav Idit, as it is written: "And to Moses He said, 'Come up to the Lord.'" Why does it say "Come up to Me" to him? He said to him: This is Metatron, whose name is like his Master's, as it is written: "For My name is within him."

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, נִיפְלְחוּ לֵיהּ! כְּתִיב: ״אַל תַּמֵּר בּוֹ״ – אַל תְּמִירֵנִי בּוֹ. אִם כֵּן, ״לֹא יִשָּׂא לְפִשְׁעֲכֶם״ לְמָה לִּי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הֵימָנוּתָא בִּידַן, דַּאֲפִילּוּ בְּפַרְוָונְקָא נָמֵי לָא קַבֵּילְנֵיהּ, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיֹּאמֶר אֵלָיו אִם אֵין פָּנֶיךָ הֹלְכִים וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: If so, we should worship him is written: “Do not defy [ tammer ] him,” Do not replace Me [ temireni ] with him. If so, why do I “For he will not pardon your transgression”? said to him: We believe that we did not accept even as a guide [ befarvanka ] as it is written: “And he said to him: If Your Presence go not with me
llm_translation: So it is, they were repelled by him! It is written: "Do not be rebellious against him" - do not rebel against me. If so, "He will not bear your iniquity" - why do I need it? He said to him: The trust is in our hands, for even with a frivolous matter we do not accept it, as it is written: "And he said to him, if Your presence does not go..."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ הָהוּא מִינָא לְרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי: כְּתִיב ״וַה׳ הִמְטִיר עַל סְדֹם וְעַל עֲמֹרָה גׇּפְרִית וָאֵשׁ מֵאֵת ה׳״, ״מֵאִתּוֹ״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ! אֲמַר לֵיהּ הָהוּא כּוֹבֵס: שִׁבְקֵיהּ, אֲנָא מַהְדַּרְנָא לֵיהּ. דִּכְתִיב ״וַיֹּאמֶר לֶמֶךְ לְנָשָׁיו עָדָה וְצִלָּה שְׁמַעַן קוֹלִי נְשֵׁי לֶמֶךְ״, נָשַׁיי מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ! אֶלָּא מִשְׁתַּעֵי קְרָא הָכִי, הָכָא נָמֵי מִשְׁתַּעֵי קְרָא הָכִי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מְנָא לָךְ הָא? מִפִּירְקֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר שְׁמִיעַ לִי.
human_translation: A certain heretic said to Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei: is written: “And the Lord rained upon Sodom and upon Gomorrah brimstone and fire from the Lord It should have From Him A certain launderer said to Leave him be; I will respond to him. as it is written: “And Lemech said to his wives: Adah and Zillah, hear my voice; wives of Lemech, It should have My wives, Rather, it is the verse speak in this Here too, it is the verse speak in this said to From where did you this said to him: I heard it at the lecture of Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: He said to him that heretic to Rabbi Yishmael son of Rabbi Yosei: It is written, "And Hashem caused to rain upon Sodom and Gomorrah brimstone and fire from Hashem," "from Him" he asked him! He said to him that launderer: Leave it, I will answer him. As it is written, "And Lemech said to his wives Adah and Zillah, Hear my voice, wives of Lemech," my wives he asked him! Rather, the verse is distorted thus, here also the verse is distorted thus. He said to him: From where do you know this? From the interpretations of Rabbi Meir you shall hear for me.

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כִּי הֲוָה דָּרֵישׁ רַבִּי מֵאִיר בְּפִירְקֵיהּ, הֲוָה דָּרֵישׁ תִּילְתָּא שְׁמַעְתָּא, תִּילְתָּא אַגָּדְתָּא, תִּילְתָּא מַתְלֵי. וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: שָׁלֹשׁ מֵאוֹת מִשְׁלוֹת שׁוּעָלִים הָיוּ לוֹ לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר, וְאָנוּ אֵין לָנוּ אֶלָּא שָׁלֹשׁ.
human_translation: as Rabbi Yoḥanan said: When Rabbi Meir would teach his lecture he would expound one-third halakha , one-third aggada , one-third parables. And Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Rabbi Meir had, three hundred parables of foxes, and we have only three.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rabbi Yochanan said: When Rabbi Meir would expound in his lectures, he would expound one-third Scripture, one-third Aggadah, and one-third Halakha. And Rabbi Yochanan said: Rabbi Meir had three hundred fox fables, but we have only three.

hebrew_text: ״אָבוֹת יֹאכְלוּ בֹסֶר וְשִׁנֵּי בָנִים תִּקְהֶינָה״, ״מֹאזְנֵי צֶדֶק אַבְנֵי צֶדֶק״, ״צַדִּיק מִצָּרָה נֶחֱלָץ וַיָּבֹא רָשָׁע תַּחְתָּיו״.
human_translation: “The fathers have eaten sour grapes, and the children’s teeth are set on edge” “Just balances, just weights “The righteous is delivered out of trouble, and the wicked comes in his stead”
llm_translation: "Fathers shall eat unripe fruit, and the teeth of sons shall be set on edge." "Scales of justice, stones of justice." "The righteous is delivered from distress, and the wicked comes in his stead."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ קֵיסָר לְרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל: אֱלֹהֵיכֶם גַּנָּב הוּא, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיַּפֵּל ה׳ אֱלֹהִים תַּרְדֵּמָה עַל הָאָדָם וַיִּישָׁן״. אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ בְּרַתֵּיה: שִׁבְקֵיהּ, דַּאֲנָא מַהְדַּרְנָא לֵיהּ. אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: תְּנוּ לִי דּוּכּוֹס אֶחָד. אֲמַר לַהּ: לְמָה לִיךְ? לִיסְטִין בָּאוּ עָלֵינוּ הַלַּיְלָה וְנָטְלוּ מִמֶּנּוּ קִיתוֹן שֶׁל כֶּסֶף וְהִנִּיחוּ לָנוּ קִיתוֹן שֶׁל זָהָב. אָמַר לָהּ: וּלְוַואי שֶׁיָּבֹאוּ עָלֵינוּ בְּכׇל יוֹם. וְלֹא יָפֶה הָיָה לוֹ לְאָדָם הָרִאשׁוֹן, שֶׁנָּטְלוּ מִמֶּנּוּ צֵלָע אַחַת וְנָתְנוּ לוֹ שִׁפְחָה לְשַׁמְּשׁוֹ?
human_translation: The emperor said to Rabban Gamliel: Your God is a thief, as it is written: “And the Lord God caused a deep sleep to fall upon the man and he slept; The daughter of said to Leave him, as I will respond to him. She said Provide one commander [ dukhus ] for me said to her: Why do you need Armed bandits came to us this night, and took a silver jug [ kiton ] from us, and left a golden jug for us. said to her: would it be that would come to us every day. And was it not good for Adam the first that took a side from him and gave him a maidservant to serve him?
llm_translation: He said to Rabban Gamliel: Your God is a thief, as it is written: "And the Lord God caused a deep sleep to fall upon the man, and he slept." His daughter said to him: Leave him alone, for I honor him. She said to him: Give me one cup. He said to her: Why do you need it? Thieves came upon us last night, took from us a silver cup, and left us a golden cup. He said to her: Would that they come upon us every day. It would not have been good for the first man if they had taken one of his ribs and given him a maidservant to serve him.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לַהּ: הָכִי קָאָמֵינָא, אֶלָּא לִשְׁקְלַיהּ בְּהֶדְיָא? אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: אַיְיתוֹ לִי אוּמְצָא דְּבִישְׂרָא. אַיְיתוֹ לַהּ. אוֹתְבַהּ תּוּתֵי בַּחְשָׁא, אַפִּיקְתַּהּ. אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: אֱכוֹל (מֵהַאי). אֲמַר לַהּ: מְאִיסָא לִי. אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: וְאָדָם הָרִאשׁוֹן נָמֵי, אִי הֲוָת שְׁקִילָה בְּהֶדְיָא, הֲוָה מְאִיסָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: said to her: This is what I was saying: But let take in the open, She said to him: Bring me raw meat. They brought it to her. She placed it under the embers, removed it She said to him: Eat from this said to her: It is repulsive to me. She said to him: Adam the first as well, had taken her in the open, she would have been repulsive to him.
llm_translation: He said to her: "Is this what I am saying, rather to weigh it with a barleycorn?" She said to him: "Bring me a barleycorn from Beisra." He brought it to her. She placed it in a crack, she removed it. She said to him: "Eat (from this)." He said to her: "It is repulsive to me." She said to him: "And Adam the first man also, if he had tasted from it, it would have been repulsive to him."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ קֵיסָר לְרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל: יָדַעְנָא אֱלָהַיְיכוּ מַאי קָא עָבֵיד וְהֵיכָן יָתֵיב. אִיתְנְגִיד וְאִיתְּנַח. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַאי הַאי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בֵּן אֶחָד יֵשׁ לִי בִּכְרַכֵּי הַיָּם וְיֵשׁ לִי גִּיעֲגוּעִים עָלָיו. בָּעֵינָא דְּמַחְוֵית לֵיהּ נִיהֲלִי. אָמַר: מִי יָדַעְנָא הֵיכָא נִיהוּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: דְּאִיכָּא בְּאַרְעָא לָא יָדְעַתְּ, דְּאִיכָּא בִּשְׁמַיָּא יָדְעַתְּ?
human_translation: The emperor said to Rabban Gamliel: I know your God, what He does and where He sits. was moaning and groaning. said to him: What this? said to him: I have one son in the cities overseas and I miss him. I want you to show him to me. said: Do I know where he is? said to him: you do not know that which is on earth, you do know that which is in the heavens?
llm_translation: He said to him, Caesar to Rabban Gamliel: "Do your gods know what he is doing and where he is sitting?" He is engaged and resting. He said to him: "What is this?" He said to him: "I have a son in the depths of the sea, and I have yearnings for him. I wish to see him." He said: "Who knows how we can see him?" He said to him: "In the land, you do not know, but in the heavens, you know."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ קֵיסָר לְרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל: כְּתִיב ״מוֹנֶה מִסְפָּר לַכּוֹכָבִים״, מַאי רְבוּתֵיהּ? אֲנָא מָצֵינָא לְמִימְנֵי כּוֹכְבֵי! אַיְיתִי חֲבוּשֵׁי, שְׁדִינְהוּ בְּאַרְבֵּילָא, וְקָא מְהַדַּר לְהוּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מְנִינְהוּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אוֹקְמִינְהוּ! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: רָקִיעַ נָמֵי הָכִי הָדְרָא.
human_translation: The emperor said to Rabban Gamliel: It is written “He counts the number of the stars; What is His greatness? I can count the stars. brought quinces, put them in a sieve, and spun them. He said Count them. said to him: Stand them still said to him: firmament also revolves like this,
llm_translation: He said to him, Caesar said to Rabban Gamliel: It is written, "He counts the number of the stars," what is its excess? I have found them to be as numerous as the stars! I brought bundles, tied them in Arbelah, and he was pleased with them. He said to him: Count them. He said to him: Establish them! He said to him: The firmament is like this, adorned.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי, הָכִי אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מְנִי לִי כּוֹכְבֵי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֵימָא לִי כַּכָּיךְ וְשִׁינָּיךְ כַּמָּה הָוֵי? שְׁדָא יְדֵיהּ לְפוּמֵּיהּ וְקָא מָנֵי לְהוּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: דְּאִיכָּא בְּפוּמָּיךְ לָא יָדְעַתְּ, דְּאִיכָּא בִּרְקִיעָא יָדְעַתְּ?
human_translation: Some say this is said to him: I have counted the stars. said to him: Tell me how many teeth and incisors you put his hand in his mouth and was counting them. said to him: You do not know what is in your mouth, you do know what is in the firmament?
llm_translation: There is one who says, thus he said to him: "Count for me the stars." He said to him: "Say to me like this and like this, how many will there be?" He spread out his hands towards the sky and began to count them. He said to him: "You do not know what is in your palms, but you know what is in the sky?"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ קֵיסָר לְרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל: מִי שֶׁבָּרָא הָרִים לֹא בָּרָא רוּחַ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״כִּי הִנֵּה יוֹצֵר הָרִים וּבֹרֵא רוּחַ״. אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, גַּבֵּי אָדָם דִּכְתִיב ״וַיִּבְרָא״ ״וַיִּיצֶר״, הָכִי נָמֵי מִי שֶׁבָּרָא זֶה לֹא בָּרָא זֶה?
human_translation: The emperor said to Rabban Gamliel: He Who created mountains did not create wind, as it is stated: “For, lo, He forms mountains and creates wind” If that is so, with regard to Adam, as it is written “And created” “And formed” so too He who created this did not create that?
llm_translation: He said to him, Caesar said to Rabban Gamliel: One who created mountains did not create wind, as it is stated, "For behold, He forms mountains and creates wind." Rather, from now on, regarding a person, as it is written, "And He created" "And He formed," is it not true that one who created this did not create that?

hebrew_text: טֶפַח עַל טֶפַח יֵשׁ בּוֹ בָּאָדָם, וּשְׁנֵי נְקָבִים יֵשׁ בּוֹ. מִי שֶׁבָּרָא זֶה לֹא בָּרָא זֶה? שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הֲנֹטַע אֹזֶן הֲלֹא יִשְׁמָע וְאִם יֹצֵר עַיִן הֲלֹא יַבִּיט״. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִין. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: וּבִשְׁעַת מִיתָה כּוּלָּן נִתְפַּיְּיסוּ?
human_translation: A person has one handbreadth by one handbreadth two orifices in it, He who created this did not create that; as it is stated: “He that planted the ear, shall He not hear? He that formed the eye, shall He not see?” said to him: Yes, said to him: And at the moment of death, are they all appeased?
llm_translation: A handbreadth upon a handbreadth there is in him, and two cavities there are in him. He who created this did not create this? As it is stated: "Does He who plants the ear not hear? Does He who forms the eye not see?" He said to him: No. He said to him: And at the time of death, were they all appeased?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ הָהוּא אַמְגּוּשָׁא לְאַמֵּימָר: מִפַּלְגָךְ לְעִילַּאי דְּהוֹרְמִיז, מִפַּלְגָךְ לְתַתַּאי דְּאַהוֹרְמִיז. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִם כֵּן, הֵיכִי שָׁבֵיק לֵיהּ אַהוֹרְמִיז לְהוֹרְמִיז לְעַבּוֹרֵי מַיָּא בְּאַרְעֵיהּ?
human_translation: A certain magus said to Ameimar: From your midpoint and up of Hurmiz, from your midpoint and down of Ahurmiz, said to him: If so, how does Ahurmiz allow Hurmiz to urinate in his territory?
llm_translation: He said to him, that one, to Amemar: From your top half that you throw, from your bottom half that you throw. He said to him: If so, how does he leave the bottom half to throw to the passersby in his land?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ קֵיסָר לְרַבִּי תַּנְחוּם: תָּא לִיהְווֹ כּוּלָּן לְעַמָּא חַד. אֲמַר: לְחַיֵּי, אֲנַן דְּמָהֲלִינַן לָא מָצֵינַן מִיהְוֵי כְּוָותַיְיכוּ. אַתּוּן מָהֲלִיתוּ וֶהֱווֹ כְּוָותַן! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מֵימָר שַׁפִּיר קָאָמְרַתְּ, מִיהוּ כֹּל דְּזָכֵי לְמַלְכָּא לִשְׁדְּיוּהּ לְבֵיבָר. שַׁדְיוּהּ לְבֵיבָר וְלָא אַכְלוּהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ הָהוּא מִינָא: הַאי דְּלָא אַכְלוּהּ מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא כְּפוּן הוּא. שַׁדְיוּהּ לֵיהּ לְדִידֵיהּ וְאַכְלוּהּ.
human_translation: The emperor said to Rabbi Tanḥum: Come, let us all be one people. said: Very well. we, who are circumcised, cannot become as you you circumcise and become like us. said to statement, you are saying well, but anyone who bests the king is thrown to the enclosure [ labeivar ] They threw him to the enclosure but did not eat him, A certain heretic said to This that they did not eat him, because they are not hungry. They threw the and ate him.
llm_translation: He said to him, Caesar said to Rabbi Tanḥum: Let all of them come to one nation. He said: By the life of us, we who are walking did not find it to be our desire. You walked and made it your desire! He said to him: The statement you made is good, for anyone who is deserving of the king, let him be sent to Bevavir. They sent him to Bevavir, but they did not eat it. That heretic said to him: They did not eat it because it was not ripe. They sent it back to him, and they ate it.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ קֵיסָר לְרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל: אָמְרִיתוּ כֹּל בֵּי עַשְׂרָה שְׁכִינְתָּא שָׁרְיָא, כַּמָּה שְׁכִינְתָּא אִיכָּא? קַרְיֵיהּ לְשַׁמָּעֵיהּ, מְחָא בֵּיהּ בְּאַפָּתְקָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַמַּאי עָל שִׁמְשָׁא בְּבֵיתֵיהּ דְּקֵיסָר? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: שִׁמְשָׁא אַכּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא נָיְחָא. וּמָה שִׁמְשָׁא דְּחַד מִן אֶלֶף אַלְפֵי רִבּוֹא שַׁמָּשֵׁי דְּקַמֵּי קוּדְשָׁא בְּרִיךְ הוּא נָיְחָא אַכּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא, שְׁכִינְתָּא דְּקוּדְשָׁא בְּרִיךְ הוּא עַל אַחַת כַּמָּה וְכַמָּה.
human_translation: The emperor said to Rabban Gamliel: You say the Divine Presence dwells any place where there are ten How many Divine Presences are there? summoned the servant hit him on his neck [ be’appatka ]. said to him: Why the sun enter the house of the emperor? The emperor said to him: The sun rests upon all the world; And if the sun, which is one of ten thousand attendants that are before the Holy One, Blessed be He, rests upon all the world, the Divine Presence of the Holy One, Blessed be He, all the more so
llm_translation: He said to him, Caesar said to Rabban Gamliel: You have said that all the households of ten are worthy of the Divine Presence, how much more so is the Divine Presence where there are two? He read to him the verse, "He who dwells in the shelter of the Most High." He struck him with a parable. He said to him: Why is the sun in the house of Caesar? He said to him: The sun is like a servant of the world, it is fitting. And if the sun, which is one of the thousands of thousands of ministering angels before the Holy One, blessed be He, is fitting for the world, how much more so is the Divine Presence of the Holy One, blessed be He, fitting for it, how much more so.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ הָהוּא מִינָא לְרַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: אֱלֹהֵיכֶם גַּחֲכָן הוּא, דְּקָאָמַר לֵיהּ לִיחֶזְקֵאל ״שְׁכַב עַל צִדְּךָ הַשְּׂמָאלִי״, וּכְתִיב ״וְשָׁכַבְתָּ עַל צִדְּךָ הַיְמָנִי״! אֲתָא הָהוּא תַּלְמִידָא, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַאי טַעְמָא דִּשְׁבִיעֲתָא? אֲמַר לְהוּ: הַשְׁתָּא אָמֵינָא לְכוּ מִילְּתָא דְּשָׁוְיָא לְתַרְוַיְיכוּ.
human_translation: A certain heretic said to Rabbi Abbahu: Your God is a jester, as He said to Ezekiel “Lie on your left side” and is written: “Lie on your right side” a certain student came said to him: What is the reason for the Sabbatical said to them: Now I will tell you something that is fit for the two of you.
llm_translation: He said to him that heretic to Rabbi Avahu: "Your God is a liar, for he said to Ezekiel 'Lie on your left side,' and it is written 'And you shall lie on your right side!' That student came, said to him: What is the reason for the contradiction? He said to him: Now I believe the matter is suitable for your argument.

hebrew_text: אָמַר הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לְיִשְׂרָאֵל: זִרְעוּ שֵׁשׁ וְהַשְׁמִיטוּ שֶׁבַע, כְּדֵי שֶׁתֵּדְעוּ שֶׁהָאָרֶץ שֶׁלִּי הִיא. וְהֵן לֹא עָשׂוּ כֵּן, אֶלָּא חָטְאוּ וְגָלוּ. מִנְהָגוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם: מֶלֶךְ בָּשָׂר וָדָם שֶׁסָּרְחָה עָלָיו מְדִינָה – אִם אַכְזָרִי הוּא, הוֹרֵג אֶת כּוּלָּן; אִם רַחְמָן הוּא, הוֹרֵג חֶצְיָם; אִם רַחְמָן מָלֵא רַחֲמִים הוּא, מְיַיסֵּר הַגְּדוֹלִים שֶׁבָּהֶן בְּיִסּוּרִין. אַף כָּךְ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא מְיַיסֵּר אֶת יְחֶזְקֵאל כְּדֵי לְמָרֵק עֲוֹנוֹתֵיהֶם שֶׁל יִשְׂרָאֵל.
human_translation: The Holy One, Blessed be He, said to the Jewish people: Sow six and withhold seventh so that that you will know that the land is Mine. But did not do so; rather, they sinned and were exiled. The manner of the world a flesh-and-blood king whose province sinned against him, if he is cruel, he kills them all; if he is compassionate, he kills half of them; if he is compassionate is full of compassion, he afflicts the leaders among them with suffering. So this the Holy One, Blessed be He, afflicts Ezekiel in order to cleanse the sins of the Jewish people.
llm_translation: The Holy One, blessed be He, said to Israel: Sow six and let go of seven, so that you will know that the land is Mine. But they did not do so, instead they sinned and were exiled. The way of the world: a king of flesh and blood who a rebellion arises against him - if he is cruel, he kills them all; if he is merciful, he kills half of them; if he is full of mercy, he punishes the great among them with afflictions. So too, the Holy One, blessed be He, afflicted Ezekiel in order to cleanse the sins of the people of Israel.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ הָהוּא מִינָא לְרַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: אֱלֹהֵיכֶם כֹּהֵן הוּא, דִּכְתִיב ״וְיִקְחוּ לִי תְּרוּמָה״. כִּי קַבְרֵיהּ לְמֹשֶׁה, בְּמַאי טְבֵיל? וְכִי תֵּימָא בְּמַיָּא, וְהָכְתִיב ״מִי מָדַד בְּשׇׁעֳלוֹ מַיִם״?
human_translation: A certain heretic said to Rabbi Abbahu: Your God is a priest, as it is written: “That they take for Me an offering [ teruma ]” When He buried Moses, in what did He immerse? And if you would say in water, but isn’t it written: “Who has measured the waters in the hollow of His hand”
llm_translation: He said to him that heretic to Rabbi Avahu: "Your God is a priest," as it is written, "And they shall take for Me a contribution." For his gravesite is to Moses, with what is he immersed? And if you will say with water, but it is written, "Who has measured the waters in the hollow of His hand?"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בְּנוּרָא טְבֵיל, דִּכְתִיב ״כִּי הִנֵּה ה׳ בָּאֵשׁ יָבוֹא״. וּמִי סָלְקָא טְבִילוּתָא בְּנוּרָא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַדְּרַבָּה, עִיקַּר טְבִילוּתָא בְּנוּרָא הוּא, דִּכְתִיב ״וְכׇל אֲשֶׁר לֹא יָבֹא בָּאֵשׁ תַּעֲבִירוּ בַמָּיִם״.
human_translation: said to him: He immersed in fire, as it is written: “For, behold, the Lord will come in fire” But is immersion in fire effective? said to him: On the contrary, the main immersion is in fire, as it is written “And all that abides not the fire you shall make to go through the water”
llm_translation: He said to him: With fire it should be immersed, as it is written, "For behold, the Lord will come in fire." Is it really possible that immersion should be with fire? He said to him: On the contrary, the main immersion is with fire, as it is written, "But everything that does not withstand fire, you shall pass through water."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ הָהוּא מִינָא לְרַבִּי אֲבִינָא: כְּתִיב ״וּמִי כְעַמְּךָ כְּיִשְׂרָאֵל גּוֹי אֶחָד בָּאָרֶץ״, מַאי רְבוּתַיְיהוּ? אַתּוּן נָמֵי עָרְבִיתוּ בַּהֲדַן, דִּכְתִיב ״כׇּל הַגּוֹיִם כְּאַיִן נֶגְדּוֹ״. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִדִּידְכוּ אַסְהִידוּ עֲלַן, דִּכְתִיב
human_translation: A certain heretic said to Rabbi Avina: It is written: “And who is like Your people, Israel, one nation in the earth” What is your greatness? You are also mixed together with us, as it is written: “All nations before Him are as nothing; said to him: One of yours, has testified for us, as it is written:
llm_translation: He said to him that heretic to Rabbi Avina: It is written, "And who is like Your people Israel, one nation on earth," what is the comparison between them? You also should interpret it in Aramaic, as it is written, "All the nations are as nothing before Him." He said to him: From your own words you have convicted us, as it is written...

hebrew_text: ״וּבַגּוֹיִם לֹא יִתְחַשָּׁב״.
human_translation: and shall not be reckoned among the nations”
llm_translation: "And among the nations, it shall not be reckoned."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר רָמֵי: כְּתִיב ״טוֹב ה׳ לַכֹּל״, וּכְתִיב ״טוֹב ה׳ לְקֹוָויו״. מָשָׁל לְאָדָם שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ פַּרְדֵּס: כְּשֶׁהוּא מַשְׁקֶה – מַשְׁקֶה אֶת כּוּלּוֹ, כְּשֶׁהוּא עוֹדֵר – אֵינוֹ עוֹדֵר אֶלָּא טוֹבִים שֶׁבָּהֶם.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar raises a contradiction: It is written “The Lord is good to all and it is written “The Lord is good to those who wait for Him, compared to a person who has an orchard. When he waters he waters all of it. when he hoes he hoes only the good among them.
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar says: It is written, "The Lord is good to all," and it is written, "The Lord is good to those who hope in Him." A parable to a person who has a garden: when he waters it, he waters all of it; when he prunes it, he only prunes the good parts of it.

hebrew_text: לְפִיכָךְ כָּל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד כּוּ׳. ״וַיַּעֲבֹר הָרִנָּה בַּמַּחֲנֶה״. אָמַר רַבִּי אַחָא בַּר חֲנִינָא: ״בַּאֲבֹד רְשָׁעִים רִנָּה״ – בַּאֲבוֹד אַחְאָב בֶּן עָמְרִי רִנָּה.
human_translation: Therefore, each and every “And the song went throughout the camp” Rabbi Aḥa bar Ḥanina says: “When the wicked perish, there is song,” When Ahab ben Omri perished, song.
llm_translation: Therefore, each and every one as it is said, "And the shout passed through the camp." Rabbi Ahah bar Hanina said: "With the destruction of the wicked, there is rejoicing" – with the destruction of Ahab son of Omri, there was rejoicing.

hebrew_text: וּמִי חָדֵי קוּדְשָׁא בְּרִיךְ הוּא בְּמַפַּלְתָּן שֶׁל רְשָׁעִים? הָכְתִיב: ״בְּצֵאת לִפְנֵי הֶחָלוּץ וְאֹמְרִים הוֹדוּ לַה׳ כִּי לְעוֹלָם חַסְדּוֹ״. וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן: מִפְּנֵי מָה לֹא נֶאֱמַר בְּהוֹדָאָה זוֹ ״כִּי טוֹב״? לְפִי שֶׁאֵין הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא שָׂמֵחַ בְּמַפַּלְתָּן שֶׁל רְשָׁעִים.
human_translation: But is the Holy One, Blessed be He, gladdened by the downfall of the wicked? Isn’t it written as they went out before the army, and say: Give thanks to the Lord, for His mercy endures forever” And Rabbi Yonatan says: For what is it not stated in this praise: for He is good, because the Holy One, Blessed be He, is not gladdened by the downfall of the wicked.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And is it possible that the Holy One, blessed be He, rejoices in the downfall of the wicked? It is written: "When one goes forth to meet the conqueror, they say, 'Give thanks to the Lord, for His kindness is eternal.'" And Rabbi Yonatan said: Why is it not stated in this thanksgiving, "for He is good"? Because the Holy One, blessed be He, does not rejoice in the downfall of the wicked.

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָן אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן: מַאי דִּכְתִיב ״וְלֹא קָרַב זֶה אֶל זֶה כׇּל הַלָּיְלָה״? בְּאוֹתָהּ שָׁעָה בִּקְּשׁוּ מַלְאֲכֵי הַשָּׁרֵת לוֹמַר שִׁירָה לִפְנֵי הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא. אָמַר לָהֶן הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: מַעֲשֵׂה יָדַי טוֹבְעִין בַּיָּם וְאַתֶּם אוֹמְרִים שִׁירָה לְפָנַי?
human_translation: As Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥman says Rabbi Yonatan says: What which is written “And the one came not near the other all the night” At that time the ministering angels desired to recite a song before the Holy One, Blessed be He. The Holy One, Blessed be He, said to them: My handiwork, are drowning in the sea, and you are reciting a song before Me?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachman said in the name of Rabbi Yonatan: What is the meaning of what is written, "And they did not approach one another all night"? At that moment, the ministering angels sought to sing a song before the Holy One, blessed be He. The Holy One, blessed be He, said to them: My handiwork is drowning in the sea, and you wish to sing before Me?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר חֲנִינָא: הוּא אֵינוֹ שָׂשׂ, אֲבָל אֲחֵרִים מֵשִׂישׂ. דַּיְקָא נָמֵי, דִּכְתִיב ״יָשִׂישׂ״ וְלָא כְּתִיב ״יָשׂוּשׂ״. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei bar Ḥanina says: He, does not rejoice but He cause others joy. is also precise, as it is written: will cause rejoicing [ yasis ] and it is not written: Will have joy [ yasus ]. Conclude from
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei bar Hanina said: He is not happy, but others are happy. Specifically stated, as it is written "he will be happy" and not written "he will be very happy." Learn from this.

hebrew_text: ״וְהַזֹּנוֹת רָחָצוּ וְגוֹ׳״, אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: לְמָרֵק שְׁתֵּי חֶזְיוֹנוֹת, אַחַת שֶׁל מִיכָיְהוּ וְאַחַת שֶׁל אֵלִיָּהוּ. בְּמִיכָיְהוּ כְּתִיב: ״אִם שׁוֹב תָּשׁוּב בְּשָׁלוֹם לֹא דִבֶּר ה׳ בִּי״; בְּאֵלִיָּהוּ כְּתִיב: ״בִּמְקוֹם אֲשֶׁר לָקְקוּ הַכְּלָבִים אֶת דַּם נָבוֹת״.
human_translation: and the harlots also washed Rabbi Elazar says: To cleanse, two visions, one of Micaiah and one of Elijah. of Micaiah, is written: “If you return at all in peace, the Lord has not spoken by me” of Elijah, is written: “In the place where the dogs licked the blood of Naboth
llm_translation: "And the harlots washed, etc." Rabbi Elazar said: To boil two cups, one of Michayahu and one of Eliyahu. Regarding Michayahu it is written: "If you return in peace, Hashem has not spoken through me." Regarding Eliyahu it is written: "In the place where the dogs licked the blood of Navot."

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: זוֹנוֹת מַמָּשׁ. אַחְאָב אִישׁ מְצוּנָּן הָיָה, וְעָשְׂתָה לוֹ אִיזֶבֶל שְׁתֵּי צוּרֵי זוֹנוֹת בְּמֶרְכַּבְתּוֹ, כְּדֵי שֶׁיִּרְאֶה אוֹתָן וְיִתְחַמֵּם.
human_translation: Rava says: actual harlots. Ahab was a frigid man, And Jezebel, fashioned two forms of harlots for him in his chariot, in order that he see them and become aroused.
llm_translation: Rava said: actual prostitutes. Ahab was a cunning man, and Jezebel made for him two images of prostitutes in his chariot, so that he would see them and be aroused.

hebrew_text: ״וְאִישׁ מָשַׁךְ בַּקֶּשֶׁת לְתֻמּוֹ וַיַּכֶּה״. רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אָמַר: לְפִי תּוּמּוֹ. רָבָא אָמַר: לְתַמֵּם שְׁתֵּי חֶזְיוֹנוֹת, אַחַת שֶׁל מִיכָיְהוּ וְאַחַת שֶׁל אֵלִיָּהוּ.
human_translation: “And a certain man drew a bow offhandedly [ letummo ] and smote Rabbi Elazar says: offhandedly [ lefi tummo ], Rava says: to make whole letammem ] two visions, one of Micaiah and one of Elijah.
llm_translation: "And a man drew the bow with full strength, and struck." Rabbi Elazar said: According to his full strength. Rava said: To fulfill two visions, one of Michaiah and one of Elijah."

hebrew_text: (סִימָן: קָרָא, וְזָכָה, בֶּאֱדוֹם.) כְּתִיב: ״וַיִּקְרָא אַחְאָב אֶל עֹבַדְיָהוּ אֲשֶׁר עַל הַבָּיִת וְעֹבַדְיָהוּ הָיָה יָרֵא [אֶת] ה׳ מְאֹד״. מַאי קָאָמַר קְרָא?
human_translation: a mnemonic Called; and merited; of Edom. is written: “And Ahab called Obadiah, who was over the household; now Obadiah feared the Lord greatly” What is the verse saying?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: (Siman: Kara, ve-zakha, be-Edom.) Ketiv: "Vayikra Achav el Ovadyahu asher al ha-bayit ve-Ovadyahu hayah yare et Hashem me'od." Mai ka'amar kera? English translation: (Topic: He read, and he was acquitted, in Edom.) It is written: "And Ahab called Obadiah, who was over the household. Now Obadiah feared the Lord greatly." What is the verse saying by "he read"?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: אָמַר לֵיהּ, בְּיַעֲקֹב כְּתִיב ״נִחַשְׁתִּי וַיְבָרְכֵנִי ה׳ בִּגְלָלֶךָ״, בְּיוֹסֵף כְּתִיב ״וַיְבָרֶךְ ה׳ אֶת בֵּית הַמִּצְרִי בִּגְלַל יוֹסֵף״. בֵּיתָא דְּהָהוּא גַּבְרָא לָא הֲוָה מִיבְּרִיךְ. שֶׁמָּא לֹא יְרֵא אֱלֹהִים אַתָּה? יָצְתָה בַּת קוֹל וְאָמְרָה: ״וְעֹבַדְיָהוּ הָיָה יָרֵא אֶת ה׳ מְאֹד״, אֲבָל בֵּיתוֹ שֶׁל אַחְאָב אֵינוֹ מְזוּמָּן לִבְרָכָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzḥak says said to is written with regard to Jacob: I have observed the signs, and the Lord has blessed me for your sake” is written with regard to Joseph: “The Lord blessed the Egyptian’s house for Joseph’s sake” The house of that man, was not blessed. Perhaps you do not fear God? a Divine Voice emerged and said: “Now Obadiah feared the Lord greatly,” but the house of Ahab is not fit for blessing
llm_translation: Rabbi Yitzchak said: He said to him, in Yaakov it is written "He has blessed me, Hashem, because of you" (Genesis 30:27), in Yosef it is written "And Hashem blessed the house of the Egyptian because of Yosef" (Genesis 39:5). The house of that man was not accustomed to blessing. Perhaps you do not fear God? A Bat Kol (heavenly voice) came out and said: "And Ovadyahu revered Hashem greatly" (1 Kings 18:3), but the house of Achav is not prepared for blessing.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא: גָּדוֹל שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר בְּעוֹבַדְיָהוּ יוֹתֵר מִמַּה שֶּׁנֶּאֱמַר בְּאַבְרָהָם, דְּאִילּוּ בְּאַבְרָהָם לָא כְּתִיב ״מְאֹד״, וּבְעוֹבַדְיָהוּ כְּתִיב ״מְאֹד״.
human_translation: Rabbi Abba says: that is stated with regard to Obadiah greater than that which is stated with regard to Abraham. As with regard to Abraham “greatly” is not written, and about Obadiah “greatly” is written.
llm_translation: Rabbi Abba said: Great, as it is stated in Obadiah, more than what is stated in Abraham, for if in Abraham it is not written "very," and in Obadiah it is written "very."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: מִפְּנֵי מָה זָכָה עוֹבַדְיָהוּ לִנְבִיאוּת? מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהֶחְבִּיא מֵאָה נְבִיאִים בַּמְּעָרָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיְהִי בְּהַכְרִית אִיזֶבֶל אֵת נְבִיאֵי ה׳ וַיִּקַּח עֹבַדְיָהוּ מֵאָה נְבִיאִים וַיַּחְבִּיאֵם חֲמִשִּׁים אִישׁ בַּמְּעָרָה וְגוֹ״. מַאי שְׁנָא חֲמִשִּׁים אִישׁ? אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: מִיַּעֲקֹב לָמַד, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְהָיָה הַמַּחֲנֶה הַנִּשְׁאָר לִפְלֵיטָה״. רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ אָמַר: לְפִי שֶׁאֵין מְעָרָה מַחְזֶקֶת יוֹתֵר מֵחֲמִשִּׁים.
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzḥak says: For what did Obadiah merit prophecy? because he concealed one hundred prophets in a cave, as it is stated: “It was so, when Jezebel cut off the prophets of the Lord, that Obadiah took one hundred prophets, and hid them, fifty men in a cave, What is different, fifty men Rabbi Elazar says: He learned from Jacob as it is stated: then the camp that is left shall escape” Rabbi Abbahu says: because there is no cave to contain more than fifty
llm_translation: Rabbi Yitzchak said: Why did Obadiah merit prophecy? Because he hid a hundred prophets in a cave, as it is stated: "And it was when Jezebel cut off the prophets of the Lord, that Obadiah took a hundred prophets and hid them, fifty men in a cave, etc." What is different about fifty men? Rabbi Elazar said: From Jacob he learned, as it is stated: "And the camp that remained was for deliverance." Rabbi Avahu said: Because a cave does not sustain more than fifty.

hebrew_text: ״חֲזוֹן עֹבַדְיָהוּ כֹּה אָמַר ה׳ אֱלֹהִים לֶאֱדוֹם וְגוֹ׳״. מַאי שְׁנָא עוֹבַדְיָה לֶאֱדוֹם?
human_translation: “The vision of Obadiah. So says the Lord God concerning Edom: What is different, Obadiah concerning Edom?
llm_translation: "Vision of Obadiah, thus said the Lord God to Edom, etc." What is the difference between Obadiah and Edom?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: אָמַר הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא, יָבֹא עוֹבַדְיָהוּ הַדָּר בֵּין שְׁנֵי רְשָׁעִים וְלֹא לָמַד מִמַּעֲשֵׂיהֶם, וְיִנָּבֵא עַל עֵשָׂו הָרָשָׁע שֶׁדָּר בֵּין שְׁנֵי צַדִּיקִים וְלֹא לָמַד מִמַּעֲשֵׂיהֶם. אָמַר אֶפְרַיִם מִקְשָׁאָה תַּלְמִידוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי מֵאִיר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי מֵאִיר: עוֹבַדְיָה גֵּר אֲדוֹמִי הָיָה. וְהַיְינוּ דְּאָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי: מִנֵּיהּ וּבֵיהּ אִבָּא נֵיזִיל בֵּיהּ נַרְגָּא.
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzḥak says: The Holy One, Blessed be He, said: Let Obadiah come, who dwells among two wicked but did not learn from their actions; and he will prophesy concerning Esau the wicked, who dwelled among two righteous but did not learn from their actions. Efrayim Miksha’a, a student of Rabbi Meir, said in the name of Rabbi Meir: Obadiah was an Edomite convert. And this is as people say: From and within the forest comes the ax to it,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yitzchak said: The Holy One, blessed be He, said, "Let Ovadyah who dwelt among two wicked individuals come and not learn from their deeds, and let him prophesy concerning Esau the wicked who dwelt among two righteous individuals and not learn from their deeds." Ephraim, the student of Rabbi Meir, said in the name of Rabbi Meir: Ovadyah was a convert from Edom. And this is what people say: "From him and through him, the father goes and the son is killed."

hebrew_text: ״וַיַּךְ אֶת מוֹאָב וַיְמַדְּדֵם בַּחֶבֶל הַשְׁכֵּב אוֹתָם אַרְצָה״. אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַי, הַיְינוּ דְּאָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי: מִינֵּיהּ וּבֵיהּ אִבָּא לֵיזִיל בֵּיהּ נַרְגָּא. כִּי אֲתָא רַב דִּימִי אָמַר: יָרֵךְ מִתּוֹכָהּ מַסְרַחַת.
human_translation: “And he smote Moab and measured them with the line, making them lie down on the ground Rabbi Yoḥanan says in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai: This is as people say: From and within the forest comes the ax to it, When Rav Dimi came he stated A thigh rots from within,
llm_translation: "And he struck Moab and measured them with a cord, laying them down on the ground." Rabbi Yochanan said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai: This is what people say, 'His heresy and his father's heresy will cause him to go astray.' When Rav Dimi came, he said: 'The thigh from within it is dislocated.'

hebrew_text: ״וַיִּקַּח אֶת בְּנוֹ הַבְּכוֹר אֲשֶׁר יִמְלֹךְ תַּחְתָּיו וַיַּעֲלֵהוּ עֹלָה עַל הַחֹמָה״. רַב וּשְׁמוּאֵל, חַד אָמַר: לְשֵׁם שָׁמַיִם, וְחַד אָמַר: לְשֵׁם עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה.
human_translation: “Then he took his eldest son, who should have reigned in his stead, and sacrificed him for a burnt offering upon the wall; Rav and Shmuel One says: for the sake of Heaven, and one says: for the sake of idol worship.
llm_translation: "And he took his firstborn son who was to reign in his place, and he offered him up as a burnt offering upon the wall." Rav and Shmuel, one said: for the sake of Heaven, and one said: for the sake of idolatry.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר לְשֵׁם שָׁמַיִם, הַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב ״וַיְהִי קֶצֶף גָּדוֹל עַל יִשְׂרָאֵל״. אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר לְשֵׁם עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה, אַמַּאי ״וַיְהִי קֶצֶף״?
human_translation: Granted, according to the one who says for the sake of Heaven, this is as it is written: “And there was great indignation against Israel,” But according to the one who says for the sake of idol worship, why “And there was…indignation”?
