llm_translation: In truth, according to the one who says it was done for the Sake of Heaven, that is as it is written, "And there was great anger upon Israel." But according to the one who says it was done for the sake of idolatry, why is it written "And there was anger"?

hebrew_text: כִּדְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי, דְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי רָמֵי: כְּתִיב ״וּכְמִשְׁפְּטֵי הַגּוֹיִם אֲשֶׁר סְבִיבוֹתֵיכֶם לֹא עֲשִׂיתֶם״, וּכְתִיב ״וּכְמִשְׁפְּטֵי הַגּוֹיִם אֲשֶׁר סְבִיבוֹתֵיכֶם עֲשִׂיתֶם״. כַּמְתוּקָּנִין שֶׁבָּהֶם – לֹא עֲשִׂיתֶם, כַּמְקוּלְקָלִין שֶׁבָּהֶם – עֲשִׂיתֶם.
human_translation: in accordance with of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi. As Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi raises a contradiction: It is written nor have you done according to the statutes of the nations that are round about you” and it is written: “You have done according to the statutes of the nations that are round about you” You did not act like the proper ones among you did act like the flawed ones among them.
llm_translation: As Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said, Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi raised a contradiction: It is written, "And according to the ordinances of the nations that surround you, you have not done," and it is written, "And according to the ordinances of the nations that surround you, you have done." The well-ordered ones among them - you have not done, the corrupted ones among them - you have done.

hebrew_text: ״וַיִּסְעוּ מֵעָלָיו וַיָּשׁוּבוּ לָאָרֶץ״. אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בַּר פָּפָּא: בְּאוֹתָהּ שָׁעָה יָרְדוּ שׂוֹנְאֵיהֶן שֶׁל יִשְׂרָאֵל לְמַדְרֵיגָה הַתַּחְתּוֹנָה.
human_translation: “And they departed from him and returned to their own land [ la’aretz ]” Rabbi Ḥanina bar Pappa says: At that time the enemies of the Jewish people, descended to the lowest level.
llm_translation: "And they journeyed from him, and returned to the land." Rabbi Chanina bar Papa said: At that moment, the enemies of the Jewish people descended to the lowest level."

hebrew_text: ״וְהַנַּעֲרָה יָפָה עַד מְאֹד״. אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בַּר פָּפָּא: עֲדַיִין לֹא הִגִּיעָה לַחֲצִי יוֹפִי שֶׁל שָׂרָה, דִּכְתִיב ״עַד מְאֹד״ – וְלֹא מְאֹד בַּכְּלָל.
human_translation: “And the damsel was very fair [ yafa ad me’od ]” Rabbi Ḥanina bar Pappa says: She still did not reach half the beauty of Sarah, as it is written: “up to very but not including “very
llm_translation: "And the girl was very beautiful." Rabbi Chanina bar Papa said: She has not yet reached half the beauty of Sarah, as it is written 'very' - and not 'very' at all."

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ אֶחָד דִּינֵי מָמוֹנוֹת
llm_translation: We will return to you regarding one of the monetary laws.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הָיוּ בּוֹדְקִין אוֹתָן בְּשֶׁבַע חֲקִירוֹת: בְּאֵיזוֹ שָׁבוּעַ, בְּאֵיזוֹ שָׁנָה, בְּאֵיזוֹ חוֹדֶשׁ, בְּכַמָּה בַּחֹדֶשׁ, בְּאֵיזֶה יוֹם, בְּאֵיזוֹ שָׁעָה, בְּאֵיזֶה מְקוֹם. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: בְּאֵיזֶה יוֹם, בְּאֵיזוֹ שָׁעָה, בְּאֵיזֶה מָקוֹם.
human_translation: would examine with seven interrogations, In which seven-year in which year in which month on which of the month on which day at which hour in what place Rabbi Yosei says: On which day at which hour, in what place.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: They would inspect them with seven examinations: In which week, in which year, in which month, on which day of the month, at what time, and in what place. Rabbi Yosei says: On which day, at what time, in what place.

hebrew_text: מַכִּירִין אַתֶּם אוֹתוֹ? הִתְרֵתֶם בּוֹ? הָעוֹבֵד עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה: אֶת מִי עָבַד, וּבַמֶּה עָבַד?
human_translation: Do you recognize him Did you warn him? one who idol worshipper, Whom, did he worship, and in what manner did he worship
llm_translation: Do you recognize him? Have you permitted him? He worships foreign worship: whom did he serve, and with what did he serve?

hebrew_text: כָּל הַמַּרְבֶּה בִּבְדִיקוֹת – הֲרֵי זֶה מְשׁוּבָּח. מַעֲשֶׂה וּבָדַק בֶּן זַכַּאי בְּעוּקְצֵי תְּאֵנִים.
human_translation: all who increase examinations, this is praiseworthy, An incident and ben Zakkai examined about the stems of figs
llm_translation: One who increases in investigations - behold, this one is praiseworthy. It is told: Ben Zakkai acted and investigated the unripe figs.

hebrew_text: מָה בֵּין חֲקִירוֹת לִבְדִיקוֹת? חֲקִירוֹת – אֶחָד אוֹמֵר ״אֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ״, עֵדוּתָן בְּטֵילָה. בְּדִיקוֹת – אֶחָד אוֹמֵר ״אֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ״, וַאֲפִילּוּ שְׁנַיִם אוֹמְרִים ״אֵין אָנוּ יוֹדְעִין״, עֵדוּתָן קַיֶּימֶת. אֶחָד חֲקִירוֹת וְאֶחָד בְּדִיקוֹת, בִּזְמַן שֶׁמַּכְחִישִׁין זֶה אֶת זֶה – עֵדוּתָן בְּטֵילָה.
human_translation: What between interrogations and examinations? interrogations, one says: I do not know their testimony is void examinations, one says: I do not know and even two say: We do not know their testimony stands. Both interrogations and examinations, at a time when contradict one another, their testimony is void.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: What is the difference between inquiries and examinations? Inquiries - one says "I do not know," their testimony is nullified. Examinations - one says "I do not know," and even if two say "we do not know," their testimony is upheld. One is inquiries and one is examinations, when they contradict each other - their testimony is nullified.

hebrew_text: אֶחָד אוֹמֵר: ״בִּשְׁנַיִם בְּחֹדֶשׁ״, וְאֶחָד אוֹמֵר: ״בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה בַּחֹדֶשׁ״ – עֵדוּתָן קַיֶּימֶת, שֶׁזֶּה יוֹדֵעַ בְּעִיבּוּרוֹ שֶׁל חֹדֶשׁ, וְזֶה אֵינוֹ יוֹדֵעַ בְּעִיבּוּרוֹ שֶׁל חֹדֶשׁ.
human_translation: one says on the second of the month, and one says on the third of the month, their testimony stands, that this knows of addition of month, and that does not know of addition of month,
llm_translation: One says: "On the second day of the month," and one says: "On the third day of the month" - their testimony stands, for this one knows the intercalation of the month, and this one does not know the intercalation of the month.

hebrew_text: אֶחָד אוֹמֵר: ״בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה״, וְאֶחָד אוֹמֵר ״בַּחֲמִשָּׁה״ – עֵדוּתָן בְּטֵילָה.
human_translation: this says on the third and one says on the fifth their testimony is void,
llm_translation: One says: "In three," and one says "In five" - their testimony is nullified.

hebrew_text: אֶחָד אוֹמֵר: ״בִּשְׁתֵּי שָׁעוֹת״, וְאֶחָד אוֹמֵר: ״בְּשָׁלֹשׁ שָׁעוֹת״ – עֵדוּתָן קַיֶּימֶת. אֶחָד אוֹמֵר: ״בְּשָׁלֹשׁ״, וְאֶחָד אוֹמֵר: ״בְּחָמֵשׁ״ – עֵדוּתָן בְּטֵילָה.
human_translation: one says at two hours, and one says at three hours, their testimony stands, one says at three and one says at five their testimony is void.
llm_translation: One says: "in two hours", and one says: "in three hours" - their testimony is upheld. One says: "in three", and one says: "in five" - their testimony is nullified.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: קַיֶּימֶת. אֶחָד אוֹמֵר ״בְּחָמֵשׁ״, וְאֶחָד אוֹמֵר ״בְּשֶׁבַע״ – עֵדוּתָן בְּטֵילָה, שֶׁבְּחָמֵשׁ חַמָּה בַּמִּזְרָח וּבְשֶׁבַע חַמָּה בַּמַּעֲרָב.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: stands, one says at five and one says at seven their testimony is void. since at five the sun in the east and at seven the sun in the west,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: It stands. One says "in five," and one says "in seven" - their testimony is nullified, because in five the sun is in the east, and in seven the sun is in the west.

hebrew_text: וְאַחַר כָּךְ מַכְנִיסִין אֶת הַשֵּׁנִי וּבוֹדְקִין אוֹתוֹ. אִם נִמְצְאוּ דִּבְרֵיהֶם מְכֻוָּונִים, פּוֹתְחִין בִּזְכוּת. אָמַר אֶחָד מִן הָעֵדִים: ״יֵשׁ לִי לְלַמֵּד עָלָיו זְכוּת״, אוֹ אֶחָד מִן הַתַּלְמִידִים: ״יֵשׁ לִי לְלַמֵּד עָלָיו חוֹבָה״ – מְשַׁתְּקִין אוֹתוֹ. אָמַר אֶחָד מִן הַתַּלְמִידִים: ״יֵשׁ לִי לְלַמֵּד עָלָיו זְכוּת״ – מַעֲלִין אוֹתוֹ וּמוֹשִׁיבִין אוֹתוֹ בֵּינֵיהֶם, וְלֹא הָיָה יוֹרֵד מִשָּׁם כׇּל הַיּוֹם כּוּלּוֹ.
human_translation: And afterward, they bring in the second and examine him. If the statements are found congruent, They open with acquit one of the witnesses said: I can teach acquit him, or one of the students I can teach him liable, silence him, one of the students said: I can to teach acquit him, they raise him and seat him among them, and he would not descend from there the entire day,
llm_translation: And afterwards they bring in the second and examine it. If their words are found to be consistent, they begin with merit. One of the witnesses said: "I have to teach in his favor," or one of the disciples said: "I have to teach an obligation on him" - they silence him. One of the disciples said: "I have to teach in his favor" - they elevate him and seat him among them, and he did not descend from there the entire day.

hebrew_text: אִם יֵשׁ מַמָּשׁ בִּדְבָרָיו, שׁוֹמְעִין לוֹ. וַאֲפִילּוּ הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״יֵשׁ לִי לְלַמֵּד עַל עַצְמִי זְכוּת״, שׁוֹמְעִין לוֹ, וּבִלְבַד שֶׁיֵּשׁ מַמָּשׁ בִּדְבָרָיו.
human_translation: If the statement of has substance, listens to him. And even says: I can teach acquit me, listens to him provided that his statement has substance.
llm_translation: If there is substance in his words, we listen to him. And even if he says, "I have merit to teach about myself," we listen to him, as long as there is substance in his words.

hebrew_text: וְאִם מָצְאוּ לוֹ זְכוּת, פְּטָרוּהוּ. וְאִם לָאו, מַעֲבִירִין אוֹתוֹ לְמָחָר, וּמִזְדַּוְּוגִין זוּגוֹת זוּגוֹת. הָיוּ מְמַעֲטִין מִמַּאֲכָל, וְלֹא הָיוּ שׁוֹתִין יַיִן כׇּל הַיּוֹם, וְנוֹשְׂאִין וְנוֹתְנִין כׇּל הַלַּיְלָה. וְלַמׇּחֳרָת מַשְׁכִּימִין וּבָאִין לְבֵית דִּין.
human_translation: And if found acquit him they excuse him. But if not they delay to following day, and assign pairs They would minimize food and they would not drink wine all day. And they deliberate all night, and the following day they arise early and come to court
llm_translation: And if they found merit for him, they exempt him. And if not, they postpone him until the next day, and they pair him off in pairs. They would minimize their eating, and they would not drink wine all day, and they would engage in buying and selling all night. And on the next day, they would rise early and come to the court.

hebrew_text: הַמְזַכֶּה אוֹמֵר: ״אֲנִי מְזַכֶּה, וּמְזַכֶּה אֲנִי בִּמְקוֹמִי״. וְהַמְחַיֵּיב אוֹמֵר: ״אֲנִי מְחַיֵּיב, וּמְחַיֵּיב אֲנִי בִּמְקוֹמִי״. הַמְלַמֵּד חוֹבָה מְלַמֵּד זְכוּת, אֲבָל הַמְלַמֵּד זְכוּת אֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לַחְזוֹר וּלְלַמֵּד חוֹבָה. טָעוּ בַּדָּבָר – שְׁנֵי סוֹפְרֵי הַדַּיָּינִין מַזְכִּירִין אוֹתוֹ. אִם מָצְאוּ לוֹ זְכוּת – פְּטָרוּהוּ, וְאִם לָאו – עוֹמְדִים לַמִּנְיָן. שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר מְזַכִּין וְאַחַד עָשָׂר מְחַיְּיבִין – זַכַּאי.
human_translation: One who acquit says: I acquit, and I acquit in my place, And one who deem liable says: I deem liable, and I deem liable in my place. One who taught liable may teach acquit, but one who taught acquit may not then teach liable. they erred in the matter, two judges’ scribes, remind him. If found acquit him they excuse him, and if not they stand to count twelve acquit and eleven deem liable, acquitted.
llm_translation: The one who claims says: "I claim, and I claim in my place." And the one who admits says: "I admit, and I admit in my place." One who teaches obligation teaches merit, but one who teaches merit cannot go back and teach obligation. If they made a mistake in the matter, the two scribes of the judges remind him. If they found merit for him - they exempt him, and if not - they stand for the count. Twelve acquit and eleven condemn - he is acquitted.

hebrew_text: שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר מְחַיְּיבִין וְאַחַד עָשָׂר מְזַכִּין, וַאֲפִילּוּ אַחַד עָשָׂר מְזַכִּין וְאַחַד עָשָׂר מְחַיְּיבִין וְאֶחָד אוֹמֵר ״אֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ״, וַאֲפִילּוּ עֶשְׂרִים וּשְׁנַיִם מְזַכִּין אוֹ מְחַיְּיבִין וְאֶחָד אוֹמֵר ״אֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ״ – יוֹסִיפוּ הַדַּיָּינִין. וְכַמָּה מוֹסִיפִין? שְׁנַיִם שְׁנַיִם, עַד שִׁבְעִים וְאֶחָד.
human_translation: twelve deem liable and eleven acquit; or even eleven acquit and eleven deem liable and one says: I do not know; or even twenty-two acquit or deem liable and one says: I do not know, the judges add And how many do they add? pairs of two until seventy-one
llm_translation: Twelve are liable and eleven are acquitted, and even if eleven are acquitted and eleven are liable and one says, "I do not know," and even if twenty-two are acquitted or liable and one says, "I do not know" - the judges increase. And how much do they increase? Two by two, up to seventy-one.

hebrew_text: שְׁלֹשִׁים וְשִׁשָּׁה מְזַכִּין וּשְׁלֹשִׁים וַחֲמִשָּׁה מְחַיְּיבִין – זַכַּאי. שְׁלֹשִׁים וְשִׁשָּׁה מְחַיְּיבִין וּשְׁלֹשִׁים וַחֲמִשָּׁה מְזַכִּין – דָּנִין אֵלּוּ כְּנֶגֶד אֵלּוּ, עַד שֶׁיִּרְאֶה אֶחָד מִן הַמְחַיְּיבִין דִּבְרֵי הַמְזַכִּין.
human_translation: thirty-six acquit and thirty-five deem liable, acquitted. thirty-six deem liable and thirty-five acquit, they deliberate these against those until one of those who deems liable sees the statements of those who acquit
llm_translation: Thirty-six acquit and thirty-five obligate - acquit. Thirty-six obligate and thirty-five acquit - these judge against those until one of the obligators sees the words of the acquitters.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: דְּאָמַר קְרָא ״וְדָרַשְׁתָּ וְחָקַרְתָּ וְשָׁאַלְתָּ הֵיטֵב״, וְאוֹמֵר ״וְהֻגַּד לְךָ וְשָׁמָעְתָּ וְדָרַשְׁתָּ הֵיטֵב״, וְאוֹמֵר ״וְדָרְשׁוּ הַשּׁוֹפְטִים הֵיטֵב״.
human_translation: From where are these matters Rav Yehuda says: as the verse states “And you shall inquire, and investigate, and ask diligently” and states “If it be told to you and you have heard it and inquired diligently” and states “And the judges shall inquire diligently”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemar mena hanei milei? Amar Rav Yehudah: De'amar kra "ve'darashta ve'chakarta ve'shaalta heitev," ve'omer "ve'hugad lekha ve'shama'ta ve'darashta heitev," ve'omer "ve'darshu hashofetim heitev." English translation: What is the conclusion regarding these matters? Rav Yehudah said: As the verse states, "and you shall inquire, and search, and ask diligently," and it also says, "and it shall be told to you, and you shall hear, and inquire diligently," and it further says, "the judges shall inquire diligently."

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא: חֲדָא חֲדָא כְּדִכְתִיבָא? דְּאִם כֵּן, לִיכְתְּבִינְהוּ רַחֲמָנָא בַּחֲדָא! כֵּיוָן דְּכוּלְּהוּ בַּהֲדֵי הֲדָדֵי כְּתִיבָא, מֵהֲדָדֵי יָלְפִי, וְכֵיוָן דְּיָלְפִי מֵהֲדָדֵי, כְּמַאן דִּכְתִיב בַּחֲדָא דָּמֵי.
human_translation: But say each one as it is written, As, if so, let the Merciful One write them in one Since they are all written together, one learns one from the other, and once one learns one from the other, are considered as if they are written in one
llm_translation: And why? One by one as it is written? If so, let the Merciful One write them together! Since all of them are written in the hands of Hadadei, Hadadei will suffice, and when Hadadei suffices from them, it is as if it is written in one.

hebrew_text: וְהָא לָא דָּמְיָאן לַהֲדָדֵי? (סִימָן: פָּלֵט, סַיִיף, הַתְרָאָה.)
human_translation: But are not similar to each other, a mnemonic Escapes, sword, forewarning.
llm_translation: And this is not similar to Hadadei? (Sign: Plate, Sword, Warning)

hebrew_text: עִיר הַנִּדַּחַת לְהָנָךְ תַּרְתֵּי לָא דָּמְיָא, שֶׁכֵּן מָמוֹנָן פָּלֵט. עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה לְהָנָךְ תַּרְתֵּי לָא דָּמְיָא, שֶׁכֵּן בְּסַיִיף. עֵדִים זוֹמְמִין לְהָנָךְ תַּרְתֵּי לָא דָּמְיָא, שֶׁכֵּן צְרִיכִים הַתְרָאָה.
human_translation: an idolatrous city not similar to those two, because their money escapes Idol worship not similar to those two, as by the sword, conspiring witnesses not similar to those two, as require forewarning
llm_translation: The city of refuge for the unintentional killer - two witnesses are not required, for their money is exempt. Idolatry - two witnesses are not required, for it is punishable by the sword. False witnesses - two witnesses are not required, for they require warning.

hebrew_text: בְּ״הֵיטֵב״ ״הֵיטֵב״ יָלְפִינַן מֵהֲדָדֵי, וּגְזֵירָה שָׁוָה מוּפְנָה. דְּאִי לָא מוּפְנָה, אִיכָּא לְמִיפְרַךְ. לָאיֵי, אַפְנוֹיֵי מוּפְנֵי. מִדַּהֲוָה לֵיהּ לְמִיכְתַּב ״וְדָרְשׁוּ וְחָקְרוּ״, וְשַׁנִּי קְרָא בְּדִיבּוּרֵיהּ בְּ״הֵיטֵב״, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ לְאַפְנוֹיֵי.
human_translation: we learn one from the other based on “diligently” “diligently.” And verbal analogy free, because if not free, can be refuted. not so [ la’ei ], they are free. Since could have written: And they inquire and investigate, and the verse modified its statement by “diligently,” learn from it to have it be free,
llm_translation: In "heitev" "heitev" we derive from Hadadei, and a similar decree is turned. For if it is not turned, there is room to refute. To where? The turning is turned. Since it is fitting for it to be written "and they shall inquire and search," and the verse repeats in its words in "heitev," learn from it to turn.

hebrew_text: וְאַכַּתִּי מוּפְנֶה מִצַּד אֶחָד הוּא! בִּשְׁלָמָא הָנָךְ תַּרְתֵּי מוּפְנֶה הוּא, מִשּׁוּם דַּהֲוָה לֵיהּ לְמִכְתַּב. אֶלָּא עִיר הַנִּדַּחַת, מַאי הֲוָה לֵיהּ לְמִכְתַּב? הָא כְּתִיבָא כּוּלְּהוּ!
human_translation: And yet it free on one side, Granted, these two, it is free, because it could have written But an idolatrous city, what could it have written They are all written.
llm_translation: And one side turned from one side it is! In truth there, two sides it is, because it was for a document. But a city of refuge, what was it for a document? It is written, all of them!

hebrew_text: הָתָם נָמֵי אַפְנוֹיֵי מוּפְנֵה, מִדַּהֲוָה לֵיהּ לְמִכְתַּב ״דָּרוֹשׁ תִּדְרֹשׁ״ אוֹ ״חָקוֹר תַּחְקֹר״, וְשַׁנִּי קְרָא בְּדִיבּוּרֵיהּ בְּ״הֵיטֵב״ – שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ לְאַפְנוֹיֵי.
human_translation: There, also free, Since could have written: You shall inquire, or: You shall investigate, and the verse modified its statement by diligently,” learn from it to have it be free
llm_translation: There, in the case of a turning face, since it is directed to him in writing "you shall surely inquire" or "you shall diligently inquire," and the verse repeated in its speech with "thoroughly" - learn from it regarding turning faces.

hebrew_text: וְאָתוּ נֶחְנָקִין בְּקַל וָחוֹמֶר מִנִּסְקָלִין וּמִנֶּהֱרָגִין, וְאָתוּ נִשְׂרָפִין בְּקַל וָחוֹמֶר מִנִּסְקָלִין.
human_translation: And learn those who are strangled by an a fortiori from those stoned and from those killed And learn those burned by an a fortiori from those stoned.
llm_translation: And they came to be strangled with a kal vachomer from being stoned and from being killed, and they came to be burned with a kal vachomer from being stoned.

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לְרַבָּנַן דְּאָמְרִי סְקִילָה חֲמוּרָה, אֶלָּא לְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן דְּאָמַר שְׂרֵיפָה חֲמוּרָה, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר?
human_translation: This works out well according to the Rabbis, who say stoning severe But according to Rabbi Shimon, who says burning severe what is there to say?
llm_translation: The sages left it, as they say stoning is severe, but for Rabbi Shimon who says burning is severe, what can be said?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: ״וְהִנֵּה אֱמֶת נָכוֹן״, ״וְהִנֵּה אֱמֶת נָכוֹן״ – הָא חַד סְרֵי. שֶׁבַע – לְשֶׁבַע חֲקִירוֹת, דַּל תְּלָת – לִגְזֵירָה שָׁוָה, פָּשָׁא לְהוּ חֲדָא.
human_translation: Rather, Rav Yehuda said: and behold it be truth, certain” and behold it be truth, certain” consequently, eleven seven to seven interrogations, remove three, for verbal analogy, one remains.
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Yehudah said: "And behold, true and correct," "And behold, true and correct" – this is one mystery. Seven – for seven investigations, poor three – for a similar decree, he revealed one.

hebrew_text: לְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, לְאֵתוֹיֵי נִשְׂרָפִין. לְרַבָּנַן, מִילְּתָא דְּאָתְיָא בְּקַל וָחוֹמֶר – טָרַח וְכָתַב לַהּ קְרָא.
human_translation: According to Rabbi Shimon, to include those burned. According to the Rabbis a matter that can be derived through an a fortiori verse takes the trouble and writes it
llm_translation: To Rabbi Shimon, for the purpose of clarification. To the Rabbis, a matter that can be derived through a fortiori reasoning - he toiled and wrote for it a verse.

hebrew_text: מְגַדֵּף בַּהּ רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: אֵימָא לְאֵתוֹיֵי שְׁמֹנֶה חֲקִירוֹת! וּשְׁמֹנֶה חֲקִירוֹת מִי אִיכָּא?! אַלְּמָה לָא? וְהָאִיכָּא לְאֵתוֹיֵי בְּכַמָּה בְּשָׁעָה. וְתַנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: הָיוּ בּוֹדְקִין אוֹתוֹ בִּשְׁמֹנֶה חֲקִירוֹת.
human_translation: Rabbi Abbahu ridiculed this Say to add eight interrogations. And are there eight interrogations? why not? But there is to add When in the hour, And this is also taught They would examine him with eight interrogations.
llm_translation: The one who reviled Rabbi Avahu: Say to bring eight investigations! And eight investigations, are there any?! Why not? And why not bring them in how many in an hour. And it was also taught thus: They would examine it with eight investigations.

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לְאַבָּיֵי אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר, דְּאָמַר: אֵין אָדָם טוֹעֶה וְלֹא כְּלוּם, וּלְהַךְ לִישָּׁנָא נָמֵי דְּאָמַר: אָדָם טוֹעֶה מַשֶּׁהוּ – שַׁפִּיר. אֶלָּא לְאַבָּיֵי אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, דְּאָמַר: אָדָם טוֹעֶה חֲצִי שָׁעָה, וּלְרָבָא דְּאָמַר: טָעוּ אִינָשֵׁי טוּבָא – מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר?
human_translation: This works out well according to Abaye of of Rabbi Meir, who says, A person does not err at all, And also according to the version that says: A person errs a bit; well. But according to Abaye of of Rabbi Yehuda, who says, A person errs half an hour, and according to Rava, who says: People err more what can be said?
llm_translation: He left it to Abbaye in the house of Rabbi Meir, who said: A person does not err for nothing, and to support this, there are those who say: A person errs sometimes - it is reasonable. But to Abbaye in the house of Rabbi Yehuda, who said: A person errs for half an hour, and according to Rava who said: People err for good - what can be said?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, לְאֵתוֹיֵי בְּכַמָּה בַּיּוֹבֵל.
human_translation: Rather, to add In how many within the jubilee,
llm_translation: Rather, to include in how many years in the Jubilee.

hebrew_text: הַיְינוּ בְּאֵיזֶה שָׁבוּעַ! אֶלָּא, לְאֵתוֹיֵי בְּאֵיזֶה יוֹבֵל. וְאִידַּךְ: כֵּיוָן דְּאָמַר בְּאֵיזֶה שָׁבוּעַ, לָא בָּעֵי בְּאֵיזֶה יוֹבֵל.
human_translation: This is In which seven-year Rather, to add In which jubilee And the other once said in which seven-year no need in which jubilee
llm_translation: This is in what week! Rather, to come in what Jubilee. And the other: Since he said in what week, he does not need in what Jubilee.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר. תַּנְיָא, אָמַר לָהֶם רַבִּי יוֹסֵי לַחֲכָמִים: לְדִבְרֵיכֶם, מִי שֶׁבָּא וְאָמַר ״אֶמֶשׁ הֲרָגוֹ״, אוֹמֵר לוֹ ״בְּאֵיזוֹ שָׁבוּעַ?״, ״בְּאֵיזוֹ שָׁנָה?״, ״בְּאֵיזֶה חֹדֶשׁ?״, ״בְּכַמָּה בַּחֹדֶשׁ?״
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei says It is taught Rabbi Yosei said to the Rabbis: According to your statement who came and said: killed last night, say to him In which seven-year in which year, in which month, on which of the month
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: It was taught, Rabbi Yosei said to the sages: According to your words, if someone comes and says, "I killed him yesterday," we ask him, "On which week?" "In which year?" "In which month?" "On what day of the month?"

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ לוֹ: לִדְבָרֶיךָ, מִי שֶׁבָּא וְאָמַר ״עַכְשָׁו הֲרָגוֹ״, אוֹמֵר לוֹ ״בְּאֵיזֶה יוֹם?״, ״בְּאֵיזֶה שָׁעָה?״, ״בְּאֵיזֶה מָקוֹם?״
human_translation: said to him: According to your statement, who came and said: killed now, say to him On which day, at which hour, in what place
llm_translation: They said to him: According to your words, if someone comes and says, "Now I killed him," he says to him, "On what day?" "At what hour?" "In what place?"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, אַף עַל גַּב דְּלָא צָרִיךְ, רָמֵינַן עֲלֵיהּ כִּדְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר. הָכָא נָמֵי, אַף עַל גַּב דְּלָא צָרִיךְ, רָמֵינַן עֲלֵיהּ כִּדְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר.
human_translation: Rather, although it is not necessary we impose on in accordance with of Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar, Here too, although it is not necessary we impose on in accordance with of Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar.
llm_translation: Rather, even though it is not necessary, we raise an objection against it like Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar. Here too, even though it is not necessary, we raise an objection against it like Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי: ״אֶמֶשׁ הֲרָגוֹ״ – שְׁכִיחַ בְּרוֹב עֵדִיּוֹת, ״עַכְשָׁיו הֲרָגוֹ״ – לָא שְׁכִיחַ בְּרוֹב עֵדִיּוֹת.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yosei killed last night, is common in most testimonies. killed now, is not common in most testimonies,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei: "Last night they killed him" - common with many witnesses, "Now they killed him" - not common with many witnesses.

hebrew_text: מַכִּירִים אַתֶּם אוֹתוֹ. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מַכִּירִים אַתֶּם אוֹתוֹ? נׇכְרִי הָרַג? יִשְׂרָאֵל הָרַג? הִתְרִיתֶם בּוֹ? קִיבֵּל עָלָיו הַתְרָאָה? הִתִּיר עַצְמוֹ לְמִיתָה? הֵמִית בְּתוֹךְ כְּדֵי דִיבּוּר?
human_translation: Do you recognize him? The Sages taught Do you recognize Did he kill a gentile? Did he kill a Jew? Did you forewarn him? Did he accept the forewarning on himself, Did he release himself to death, Did he kill within for speaking
llm_translation: You recognize him. The Rabbis taught: Do you recognize him? Did a non-Jew kill? Did a Jew kill? Did you warn him? Did he accept a warning? Did he willingly expose himself to danger? Did he die within the time it takes to speak?

hebrew_text: הָעוֹבֵד עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה. אֶת מִי עָבַד: לִפְעוֹר עָבַד? לְמַרְקוּלִיס עָבַד? וּבַמָּה עָבַד: בְּזִיבּוּחַ? בְּקִיטּוּר? בְּנִיסּוּךְ? בְּהִשְׁתַּחֲוָאָה?
human_translation: one who idol worshipper, Whom did he worship? Did he worship Peor? Did he worship Markulis? And in what did he worship? by sacrificing by burning by pouring as a libation, by prostrating
llm_translation: The one who serves idolatry. Whom did he serve: Pe'or did he serve? Markulis did he serve? And with what did he serve: with slaughter? with incense? with libation? with prostration?

hebrew_text: אָמַר עוּלָּא: מִנַּיִין לְהַתְרָאָה מִן הַתּוֹרָה? שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְאִישׁ אֲשֶׁר יִקַּח אֶת אֲחֹתוֹ בַּת אָבִיו אוֹ בַת אִמּוֹ וְרָאָה אֶת עֶרְוָתָהּ״. אַטּוּ בִּרְאִיָּה תַּלְיָא מִילְּתָא? אֶלָּא עַד שֶׁיַּרְאוּהוּ טַעְמוֹ שֶׁל דָּבָר. אִם אֵינוֹ עִנְיָן לְכָרֵת –
human_translation: Ulla says: From where in the Torah of forewarning As it is stated: “And if a man shall take his sister, his father’s daughter, or his mother’s daughter, and see her nakedness Is that to say the matter is dependent on sight? Rather, until he sees the reason of the matter, If is not needed for the matter of excision [ karet ],
llm_translation: Ula said: From where do we derive the concept of seeing the Ervah from the Torah? As it is stated: "And a man who takes his sister, the daughter of his father or the daughter of his mother, and he sees her nakedness." Is the matter dependent on actual seeing? Rather, it is until his mind perceives the matter. If it is not a matter for excision –

hebrew_text: תְּנֵהוּ עִנְיָן לְמַלְקוּת.
human_translation: apply it to the matter of lashes,
llm_translation: Give him a matter for lashes.

hebrew_text: דְּבֵי חִזְקִיָּה תָּנָא: ״וְכִי יָזִד אִישׁ עַל רֵעֵהוּ לְהׇרְגוֹ בְעׇרְמָה״ – שֶׁהִתְרוּ בּוֹ, וַעֲדַיִין הוּא מֵזִיד.
human_translation: The school of Ḥizkiyya taught “But if a man come intentionally upon his neighbor to slay him with guile” that they forewarned him, and still he intentionally.
llm_translation: In the study hall of Hezekiah it was taught: "If a man willfully schemes against his fellow to kill him treacherously" - they permitted him, and he is still considered intentional.

hebrew_text: דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל תָּנָא: ״הַמֹּצְאִים אִתּוֹ מְקֹשֵׁשׁ עֵצִים״ – שֶׁהִתְרוּ בּוֹ, וַעֲדַיִין הוּא מְקוֹשֵׁשׁ.
human_translation: The school of Rabbi Yishmael taught they that found him gathering sticks that they forewarned him, but still gathering.
llm_translation: In the school of Rabbi Yishmael it was taught: "Those who were gathering wood with him" - they were permitted, and yet he is still gathering wood.

hebrew_text: דְּבֵי רַבִּי תָּנָא: ״עַל דְּבַר אֲשֶׁר עִנָּה״ – עַל עִסְקֵי דִּיבּוּר.
human_translation: The school of Rabbi taught “For the matter [ devar ] that he has humbled For matters speech [ dibbur ],
llm_translation: Houses of Rabbi taught: "On account of that which he afflicted" - concerning matters of speech.

hebrew_text: וּצְרִיכָא, דְּאִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״אֲחֹתוֹ״ – הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: חַיָּיבֵי מַלְקוֹת – אִין, חַיָּיבֵי מִיתוֹת – לָא. כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״כִּי יָזִד״.
human_translation: And necessary since if the Merciful One write “his sister” I would say: Those liable lashes, yes, those liable capital punishments, not the Merciful One writes, “If come intentionally.”
llm_translation: The matter is, if the Merciful One wrote "his sister" - I would say: liable to lashes - no, liable to death penalties - yes. The Merciful One wrote "when he commits adultery."

hebrew_text: וְאִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״וְכִי יָזִד״, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: הָנֵי מִילֵּי – סַיִיף דְּקִיל, אֲבָל סְקִילָה דַּחֲמוּרָה – אֵימָא לָא. צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: And if the Merciful One write “If come intentionally,” I would say this statement sword, as a lenient But stoning, which a severe say not necessary
llm_translation: "And if the Merciful One wrote 'and if he willfully assaults,' I would say: these matters - a light sword, but stoning of a donkey - I would say no. It is necessary."

hebrew_text: וְתַרְתֵּי בְּנִסְקָלִין לְמָה לִי? לְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, לְאֵתוֹיֵי נִשְׂרָפִין.
human_translation: And why do I two in stoned? According to Rabbi Shimon to add those burned
llm_translation: And two cases of stoning, why are they to me? To Rabbi Shimon, for the coming of the burnt offerings.

hebrew_text: לְרַבָּנַן, מִילְּתָא דְּאָתְיָא בְּקַל וָחוֹמֶר טָרַח וְכָתַב לַהּ קְרָא. וְלִכְתּוֹב רַחֲמָנָא בְּנִסְקָלִין, וְלֵיתוֹ הָנָךְ וְלִיגְמְרוּ מִינֵּיהּ? הָכָא נָמֵי, מִילְּתָא דְּאָתְיָא בְּקַל וָחוֹמֶר טָרַח וְכָתַב לַהּ קְרָא.
human_translation: According to the Rabbis a matter that can be derived through an a fortiori verse takes the trouble and writes it But let the Merciful One write in those stoned, and let these be derived from it, Here too, a matter that can be derived through an a fortiori verse takes the trouble and writes it
llm_translation: To the Rabbis, a matter that comes through a fortiori reasoning, he exerted effort and wrote for it a verse. And to write that the Merciful One is with the persecuted, and there is no one to save them and to finish them off? Here too, a matter that comes through a fortiori reasoning, he exerted effort and wrote for it a verse.

hebrew_text: הִתִּיר עַצְמוֹ לְמִיתָה, מְנָא לַן? אָמַר רָבָא, וְאִיתֵּימָא חִזְקִיָּה, אָמַר קְרָא: ״יוּמַת הַמֵּת״ – עַד שֶׁיַּתִּיר עַצְמוֹ לְמִיתָה.
human_translation: Did he release himself to death, From where do we Rava said, and some say Ḥizkiyya the verse states: the dead be put to death” until he releases himself to death,
llm_translation: He permitted himself to death, from where do we know? Rava said, and it was taught in the name of Hezekiah, a verse says: "Let the dead die" - until he permits himself to death.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חָנָן: עֵדֵי נַעֲרָה הַמְאוֹרָסָה שֶׁהוּזַּמּוּ אֵין נֶהֱרָגִין, מִתּוֹךְ שֶׁיְּכוֹלִים לוֹמַר ״לְאוֹסְרָהּ עַל בַּעְלָהּ בָּאנוּ״.
human_translation: Rav Ḥanan says: Witnesses of a betrothed young woman who were rendered conspiring witnesses are not killed. because they can say: we came to forbid her to her husband,
llm_translation: Rav Hanan said: Witnesses of a betrothed maiden who were proven to be conspiring are not executed, because they can say, "We came to forbid her to her husband."

hebrew_text: וְהָא אַתְרוֹ בַּהּ? דְּלָא אַתְרוֹ בַּהּ. וְאִי לָא אַתְרוֹ בַּהּ, הֵיכִי מִיקַּטְלָא?
human_translation: But they forewarned her where they did not forewarn her. But if they did not forewarn her, how can she be killed?
llm_translation: And he found in it? That he did not find in it. And if he did not find in it, how is he to kill?

hebrew_text: בְּאִשָּׁה חֲבֵירָה, וְאַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה. דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: חָבֵר אֵין צָרִיךְ הַתְרָאָה, לְפִי שֶׁלֹּא נִתְּנָה הַתְרָאָה אֶלָּא לְהַבְחִין בֵּין שׁוֹגֵג לְמֵזִיד.
human_translation: with regard to a woman a ḥavera , and in accordance with of Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda. As it is taught Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: A ḥaver does not require forewarning because forewarning is given only in order to distinguish between an intentional an unintentional
llm_translation: In a case of a fellow's wife, and the statement of Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda. As it was taught: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: A fellow does not require warning, because warning was only given to distinguish between unintentional and intentional.

hebrew_text: וְכֵיוָן דְּאִינְהוּ לָא מִיקַּטְלִי, אִיהִי הֵיכִי מִיקַּטְלָא? הָוְיָא לַהּ עֵדוּת שֶׁאִי אַתָּה יָכוֹל לַהֲזִימָּהּ, וְכׇל עֵדוּת שֶׁאִי אַתָּה יָכוֹל לַהֲזִימָּהּ לֹא שְׁמָהּ עֵדוּת.
human_translation: But since are not killed how can she be killed testimony that you cannot render conspiratory and any testimony that you cannot render conspiratory not categorized as testimony.
llm_translation: And since they do not kill him, how is he killed? Let there be testimony that you cannot contradict, and any testimony that you cannot contradict is not called testimony.

hebrew_text: הָכִי נָמֵי קָאָמַר: מִתּוֹךְ שֶׁאֵין נֶהֱרָגִין, שֶׁיְּכוֹלִין לוֹמַר ״לְאוֹסְרָהּ עַל בַּעְלָהּ בָּאנוּ״, אַף הִיא אֵינָהּ נֶהֱרֶגֶת, דְּהָוְיָא לַהּ עֵדוּת שֶׁאִי אַתָּה יָכוֹל לַהֲזִימָּהּ.
human_translation: That is also what he is saying: Since are not killed, as they can say: We came to forbid her to her husband, she is also not killed, since is testimony that you cannot render conspiratory
llm_translation: So it was stated: Because they are not killed, they can say, "We have come to forbid her to her husband." Likewise, she is not killed, for it would be a false testimony against her that you cannot accuse her.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא בְּאִשָּׁה חֲבֵירָה, דְּקַיְימָא לַן דְּמִיקַּטְלָא, אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה הֵיכִי מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ? כְּשֶׁזִּינְּתָה, וְחָזְרָה וְזִינְּתָה.
human_translation: But with regard to a woman a ḥavera , since we maintain that she killed how can you find this according to of Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda? where she committed adultery and then she again committed adultery.
llm_translation: Rather, with regard to a fellow woman, since it is established for us that she is a murderer, according to the opinion of Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, how do you find her? When she has committed adultery, and then returned and committed adultery again.

hebrew_text: וְהָא יְכוֹלִין לוֹמַר: ״לְאוֹסְרָהּ עַל בּוֹעֲלָהּ שֵׁנִי בָּאנוּ״! שֶׁזִּינְּתָה מִבּוֹעֵל רִאשׁוֹן, אִי נָמֵי שֶׁזִּינְּתָה מִקְּרוֹבֶיהָ.
human_translation: But can say: We come to forbid her to her second paramour. where she committed adultery with the first paramour, Alternatively, where she committed adultery with her relatives,
llm_translation: And can they say, "To prohibit her upon her second husband"? Because she was fed by the first husband, or rather because she was fed by her relatives.

hebrew_text: מַאי שְׁנָא נַעֲרָה מְאוֹרָסָה דְּנָקֵט? אֲפִילּוּ נְשׂוּאָה נָמֵי! אִין, אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ הַאי דְּלָא יָתְבָא תּוּתֵיהּ יְכוֹלִין לוֹמַר: ״לְאוֹסְרָהּ עַל בַּעְלָהּ בָּאנוּ״.
human_translation: What is different that chose a betrothed young woman? a married woman as well. Yes, But even this who does not live under can say: We came to forbid her to her husband.
llm_translation: What is the difference between a betrothed maiden who is taken captive? Even if she is married! No, rather, even in a case where she has not yet entered under the marriage canopy, they can say, "We have come to prohibit her to her husband."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: אֶחָד אוֹמֵר ״בְּסַיִיף הֲרָגוֹ״, וְאֶחָד אוֹמֵר ״בַּאֲרִירָן הֲרָגוֹ״ – אֵין זֶה ״נָכוֹן״. אֶחָד אוֹמֵר ״כֵּלָיו שְׁחוֹרִין״, וְאֶחָד אוֹמֵר ״כֵּלָיו לְבָנִים״ – הֲרֵי זֶה ״נָכוֹן״.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda says: one says: killed with a sword, and one says: killed with an ariran , this is not congruent one says: garments black, and one says: garments white, this is congruent
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: One says, "He was killed with a sword," and one says, "He was killed with a spear" – this is not correct. One says, "His kidneys were black," and one says, "His kidneys were white" – this is correct.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: ״נָכוֹן״ – שֶׁיְּהֵא נָכוֹן. אֶחָד אוֹמֵר: ״בְּסַיִיף הֲרָגוֹ״, וְאֶחָד אוֹמֵר: ״בַּאֲרִירָן הֲרָגוֹ״. אֶחָד אוֹמֵר: ״כֵּלָיו שְׁחוֹרִין״, וְאֶחָד אוֹמֵר: ״כֵּלָיו לְבָנִים״ – אֵין זֶה ״נָכוֹן״. תַּרְגְּמַהּ רַב חִסְדָּא: בְּסוּדָר שֶׁחֲנָקוֹ בּוֹ, דְּהַיְינוּ סַיִיף וַאֲרִירָן.
human_translation: raises an objection “certain” must be congruent. one says: killed with a sword, and one says: killed with an ariran , one says: garments black, and one says: garments white, this is not congruent Rav Ḥisda interpreted about a scarf with which strangled as this is a sword and an ariran .
llm_translation: The question was raised: "Ready" - that it should be ready. One says: "He was killed with a sword," and one says: "He was killed with a stake." One says: "His kidneys were black," and one says: "His kidneys were white" - this is not "ready." Rav Ḥisda interpreted it: in a manner that he was choked with it, meaning a sword and a stake.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: אֶחָד אוֹמֵר ״סַנְדָּלָיו שְׁחוֹרִין״, וְאֶחָד אוֹמֵר ״סַנְדָּלָיו לְבָנִים״ – אֵין זֶה ״נָכוֹן״. הָתָם נָמֵי, כְּגוֹן שֶׁבָּעַט בּוֹ בְּסַנְדָּלוֹ וַהֲרָגוֹ.
human_translation: Come hear one says: sandals of black, and one says: sandals of white, this is not congruent there also, where kicked with his sandal and killed him.
llm_translation: Come and hear: One says, "His sandals are black," and one says, "His sandals are white" - this is not correct. There, it is talking about a case where he kicked him with his sandal and killed him.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: מַעֲשֶׂה, וּבָדַק בֶּן זַכַּאי בְּעוּקְצֵי תְּאֵנָה. אָמַר רָמֵי בַּר חָמָא: כְּגוֹן שֶׁעָקַץ תְּאֵנָה בְּשַׁבָּת, דַּעֲלַהּ קָא מִיקְּטִיל.
human_translation: Come hear An incident and ben Zakkai examined about the stems of figs, Rami bar Ḥama said: where he picked a fig on Shabbat, as he is killed for that
llm_translation: Come and hear: There was an incident, and Ben Zakkai examined fig cakes. Ramei bar Hama said: For example, if one pricks a fig on Shabbat, he is liable for desecrating the Sabbath.

hebrew_text: וְהָא תַּנְיָא: אָמְרוּ לוֹ ״תַּחַת תְּאֵנָה הֲרָגוֹ״? אֶלָּא אָמַר רָמֵי בַּר חָמָא: כְּגוֹן שֶׁשִּׁפְּדוֹ בְּיִיחוּר שֶׁל תְּאֵנָה.
human_translation: But isn’t it taught they said to him: killed beneath a fig tree, Rather, Rami bar Ḥama said: where stabbed with a branch of a fig tree.
llm_translation: The Gemara asks: Did they say to him, "You shall be killed under a fig tree"? Rather, Ramei bar Hama said: For example, they redeemed him with the value of a fig tree.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, אָמַר לָהֶן: תְּאֵנָה זוֹ עֳקָצֶיהָ דַּקִּין? עֳקָצֶיהָ גַּסִּין? תְּאֵנִים שְׁחוֹרוֹת? תְּאֵנִים לְבָנוֹת? אֶלָּא, אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: מִבֶּן זַכַּאי לוֹתֵיב אִינִישׁ? שָׁאנֵי בֶּן זַכַּאי, דִּבְדִיקוֹת כַּחֲקִירוֹת מְשַׁוֵּי לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Come hear said to This fig its stems thin its stems thick? figs black figs white? Rather, Rav Yosef says: Should a person raise a difficulty from ben Zakkai? Ben Zakkai is different, as he equated examinations with interrogations.
llm_translation: Come and hear, he said to them: Is the fig tree with its thorns? With its thorns? Black figs? White figs? Rather, Rav Yosef said: From the age of six, does a person sit? It is different with Ben Zakai, for his investigations are like examinations to him.

hebrew_text: מַאן בֶּן זַכַּאי? אִילֵּימָא רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן זַכַּאי, מִי הֲוָה בְּסַנְהֶדְרִי? וְהָתַנְיָא: כׇּל שְׁנוֹתָיו שֶׁל רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן זַכַּאי מֵאָה וְעֶשְׂרִים שָׁנָה. אַרְבָּעִים שָׁנָה עָסַק בִּפְרַקְמַטְיָא, אַרְבָּעִים שָׁנָה לָמַד, אַרְבָּעִים שָׁנָה לִימֵּד.
human_translation: Who ben Zakkai If we say Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Zakkai, was he in a Sanhedrin But isn’t it taught All the years of Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Zakkai 120 years. forty years he dealt in business [ biferakmatya ], forty years he studied, and forty years he taught
llm_translation: Who was Ben Zakkai? If you say Rabbi Yochanan ben Zakkai, was he a member of the Sanhedrin? And it was taught: All the years of Rabbi Yochanan ben Zakkai were one hundred and twenty years. Forty years he engaged in the study of Perek Mattya, forty years he taught, and forty years he imparted.

hebrew_text: וְתַנְיָא: אַרְבָּעִים שָׁנָה קוֹדֶם חוּרְבַּן הַבַּיִת, גָּלְתָה סַנְהֶדְרִין וְיָשְׁבָה לָהּ בַּחֲנוּת. וְאָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק בַּר אֲבוּדִימִי: לוֹמַר שֶׁלֹּא דָּנוּ דִּינֵי קְנָסוֹת. דִּינֵי קְנָסוֹת סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ? אֶלָּא שֶׁלֹּא דָּנוּ דִּינֵי נְפָשׁוֹת.
human_translation: And it is taught Forty years before the destruction of the Temple, the Sanhedrin was exiled and sat in the store And Rabbi Yitzḥak bar Avudimi says: to say that no judged laws of fines. enter your mind laws of fines? Rather, that no judged capital law.
llm_translation: And it was taught in a Baraita: Forty years before the destruction of the Temple, the Sanhedrin was exiled and sat in the Chanut. And Rabbi Yitzchak bar Avudimi said: To say that they did not judge cases of fines. Cases of fines, is it your opinion? Rather, they did not judge cases of capital punishment.

hebrew_text: וּתְנַן: מִשֶּׁחָרַב בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ, הִתְקִין רַבָּן יוֹחָנָן בֶּן זַכַּאי.
human_translation: And we learned Once the Temple was destroyed, Rabban Yoḥanan ben Zakkai instituted
llm_translation: And we learned in a Mishnah: From when the Beit HaMikdash was destroyed, Rabban Yochanan ben Zakkai instituted...

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, בֶּן זַכַּאי דְּעָלְמָא. הָכִי נָמֵי מִסְתַּבְּרָא, דְּאִי סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ רַבָּן יוֹחָנָן בֶּן זַכַּאי, קָרֵי לֵיהּ רַבִּי ״בֶּן זַכַּאי״?
human_translation: Rather, merely ben Zakkai, So too, it is reasonable as if it enters your mind Rabban Yoḥanan ben Zakkai, would Rabbi call him ben Zakkai,
llm_translation: Rather, Ben Zakkai of the world. Thus it appears fitting, for if it were to enter your mind, Rabban Yochanan ben Zakkai, why is he called "Rabbi 'Ben Zakkai'?"

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא: מַעֲשֶׂה וּבָדַק רַבָּן יוֹחָנָן בֶּן זַכַּאי בְּעוּקְצֵי תְּאֵנִים! אֶלָּא, תַּלְמִיד הַיּוֹשֵׁב לִפְנֵי רַבּוֹ הֲוָה, וַאֲמַר מִילְּתָא וּמִסְתַּבַּר לְהוּ טַעְמֵיהּ,
human_translation: But isn’t it taught An incident and Rabban Yoḥanan ben Zakkai examined with regard to the stems of figs? Rather, was a student sitting before his teacher, And he said a matter and his reasoning was logical to them,
llm_translation: And it was taught: There was an incident where Rabban Yochanan ben Zakkai examined fig cakes! Rather, a student who was sitting before his teacher was present, and he stated a matter and explained its reasoning to them.

hebrew_text: וְקַבְעוּהָ בִּשְׁמֵיהּ. כִּי הֲוָה לָמַד, ״בֶּן זַכַּאי״ הֲוָה קָרֵי לֵיהּ, כְּתַלְמִיד הַיּוֹשֵׁב לִפְנֵי רַבּוֹ. כִּי הֲוָה לִימֵּד, הֲוָה קָרֵי לֵיהּ ״רַבָּן יוֹחָנָן בֶּן זַכַּאי״. כִּי קָרֵי לֵיהּ ״בֶּן זַכַּאי״ – עַל שֵׁם דְּמֵעִיקָּרָא, וְכִי קָרֵי לֵיהּ ״רַבָּן יוֹחָנָן בֶּן זַכַּאי״ – עַל שֵׁם דְּהַשְׁתָּא.
human_translation: and established it in his name. When he was studying, they called him ben Zakkai, in the manner a student sitting before his teacher, when he was teaching they called him Rabban Yoḥanan ben Zakkai. when they called him ben Zakkai based on the name that initially. And when they called him Rabban Yoḥanan ben Zakkai based on the name that now.
llm_translation: And establish her by his name. For he had learned, "Ben Zakkai" was called, like a student sitting before his teacher. When he had taught, he was called "Rabban Yochanan ben Zakkai." When he was called "Ben Zakkai" - because of the main source, and when he was called "Rabban Yochanan ben Zakkai" - because of the current situation.

hebrew_text: מַעֲשֶׂה וּבָדַק כּוּ׳. מָה בֵּין חֲקִירוֹת כּוּ׳. מַאי ״אֲפִילּוּ שְׁנַיִם אוֹמְרִים״? פְּשִׁיטָא! כִּי אָמַר אֶחָד ״אֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ״ – עֵדוּתָן קַיֶּימֶת, כִּי אָמְרִי בֵּי תְרֵי נָמֵי עֵדוּתָן קַיֶּימֶת!
human_translation: An incident and examined What between interrogations What Even two say? obvious? when one says: I do not know, their testimony stands, when two say their testimony stands as well.
llm_translation: The matter of "and he shall examine it." What is the difference between inquiries, etc.? What is meant by "even if two say"? It is obvious! For if one says "I do not know" - their testimony is valid, for the sages of the two houses said their testimony is valid!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: אַרֵישָׁא קָאֵי, וְהָכִי קָאָמַר: בַּחֲקִירוֹת, אֲפִילּוּ שְׁנַיִם אוֹמְרִים ״יָדַעְנוּ״ וְאֶחָד אוֹמֵר ״אֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ״ – עֵדוּתָן בְּטֵילָה. כְּמַאן? כְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, דְּמַקֵּישׁ שְׁלֹשָׁה לִשְׁנַיִם.
human_translation: Rav Sheshet said: referring to the first clause and this is saying: With regard to the interrogations, even two say: We know, and one says: I do not know, their testimony is void. In accordance with whose In accordance with Rabbi Akiva, who compares three to two,
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet said: He stands in the first place, and thus he said: In inquiries, even if two say "we know" and one says "I do not know" - their testimony is null. Whose opinion? Like that of Rabbi Akiva, who compares three to two.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: וְהָא ״עֵדוּתָן קַיֶּימֶת״ קָתָנֵי! אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: הָכִי קָאָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ בַּחֲקִירוֹת, שְׁנַיִם אוֹמְרִים ״יָדַעְנוּ״ וְאֶחָד אוֹמֵר ״אֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ״ – עֵדוּתָן קַיֶּימֶת. כְּמַאן? דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא.
human_translation: Rava says: But teaches: Their testimony stands, Rather, Rava said: This is saying: Even with regard to the interrogations, two say: We know, and one says: I do not know, their testimony stands, In accordance with whose Not in accordance with Rabbi Akiva.
llm_translation: Rava said: But isn't it taught, "Their testimony stands"? Rather, Rava said: This is what he meant to say: Even in inquiries, if two say, "We know," and one says, "I do not know" – their testimony stands. Like whom? Not like Rabbi Akiva.

hebrew_text: רַב כָּהֲנָא וְרַב סָפְרָא תָּנוּ סַנְהֶדְרִין בֵּי רַבָּה. פְּגַע בְּהוּ רָמֵי בַּר חָמָא. אֲמַר לְהוּ: מַאי אָמְרִיתוּ בַּהּ בְּסַנְהֶדְרִין דְּבֵי רַבָּה? אָמְרִי לֵיהּ: וּמַאי אָמְרִינַן בַּהּ בְּסַנְהֶדְרִין גְּרֵידְתָּא? וּמַאי קַשְׁיָא לָךְ?
human_translation: Rav Kahana and Rav Safra studied Sanhedrin the school of Rabba. Rami bar Ḥama encountered them. said to them: What do you say concerning Sanhedrin in the school of Rabba? said to him: And what do we say concerning the regular Sanhedrin ? And what is difficult for you?
llm_translation: Rav Kahana and Rav Safra taught Sanhedrin in the study hall of Rabba. Ramei bar Ḥama encountered them. He said to them: What did you say in it in the Sanhedrin of the study hall of Rabba? They said to him: And what do we say in it in the Sanhedrin of the lower chamber? What difficulty do you have?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לְהוּ, מֵהָא דְּקָתָנֵי: מָה בֵּין חֲקִירוֹת לִבְדִיקוֹת? חֲקִירוֹת – אֶחָד אוֹמֵר ״אֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ״, עֵדוּתָן בְּטֵילָה, בְּדִיקוֹת – אָמַר אֶחָד ״אֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ״, וַאֲפִילּוּ שְׁנַיִם אוֹמְרִים ״אֵין אָנוּ יוֹדְעִים״, עֵדוּתָן קַיֶּימֶת. מִכְּדֵי, אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא הִיא, מַאי שְׁנָא חֲקִירוֹת וּמַאי שְׁנָא בְּדִיקוֹת?
human_translation: said to them: from that which is taught What between interrogations and examinations? interrogations, one says: I do not know their testimony is void examinations, one says: I do not know and even two say: We do not know their testimony stands. After all, this and that are by Torah law; what is different interrogations and what is different examinations?
llm_translation: He said to them, from that which is taught: What is the difference between inquiries and examinations? Inquiries - one says "I do not know," their testimony is nullified. Examinations - one says "I do not know," and even if two say "we do not know," their testimony stands. Since both are from the Torah, what is the difference between inquiries and examinations?

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי לֵיהּ: הָכִי הַשְׁתָּא? בַּחֲקִירוֹת, אָמַר אֶחָד ״אֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ״ – עֵדוּתָן בְּטֵילָה, דְּהָוְיָא לַהּ עֵדוּת שֶׁאִי אַתָּה יָכוֹל לַהֲזִימָּהּ. בְּדִיקוֹת, אָמַר אֶחָד מֵהֶן ״אֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ״ – עֵדוּתָן קַיֶּימֶת, עֵדוּת שֶׁאַתָּה יָכוֹל לַהֲזִימָּהּ הוּא.
human_translation: said to him: How can be compared? With regard to the interrogations, one says: I do not know, their testimony is void, as it is testimony that you cannot render conspiratory examinations, one of the says: I do not know, their testimony stands, it is testimony that you can render conspiratory
llm_translation: They said to him: Is it so now? In inquiries, if one says "I do not know" - their testimony is nullified, for it becomes a testimony that you cannot challenge. In examinations, if one of them says "I do not know" - their testimony stands, a testimony that you can challenge it is.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לְהוּ: אִי הָכִי אָמְרִיתוּ בַּהּ, טוּבָא אָמְרִיתוּ בַּהּ. אָמְרִי לֵיהּ: מִטֵּיבוּתֵיהּ דְּמָר אָמְרִינַן בַּהּ טוּבָא, מִנְּזִיהוּתֵיהּ דְּמָר לָא אָמְרִינַן בַּהּ וְלָא חֲדָא.
human_translation: said to them: If you said like this about you said much about it. said to him: Due to the Master’s goodness, we said much about it. with the Master’s rebuke we would not say one about it,
llm_translation: He said to them: If you said this, you have said well. They said to him: From the goodness of the master we say well, from the sharpness of the master we do not say well, and not one.

hebrew_text: אֶחָד אוֹמֵר כּוּ׳. עַד כַּמָּה? אָמַר רַבִּי אַחָא בַּר חֲנִינָא, אָמַר רַבִּי אַסִּי, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: עַד רוּבּוֹ שֶׁל חוֹדֶשׁ.
human_translation: one says Until how many Rabbi Aḥa bar Ḥanina says Rabbi Asi says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Until the majority of the month
llm_translation: One says: Until when? Rabbi Ahah bar Hanina said, Rabbi Assi said, Rabbi Yochanan said: Until the majority of the month.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: אַף אֲנַן נָמֵי תְּנֵינָא, אֶחָד אוֹמֵר ״בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה״ וְאֶחָד אוֹמֵר ״בַּחֲמִשָּׁה״ – עֵדוּתָן בְּטֵילָה. וְאַמַּאי? נֵימָא שֶׁזֶּה יוֹדֵעַ בִּשְׁנֵי עִיבּוּרִין וְזֶה אֵינוֹ יוֹדֵעַ בִּשְׁנֵי עִיבּוּרִין? אֶלָּא לָאו, מִשּׁוּם דִּבְרוּבָּה יָדַע!
human_translation: Rava says: We learn as well, one says on the third and one says on the fifth their testimony is void. But why Let us say as this knows of two additions, and that does not know of the two additions. Rather, not because once the majority knows
llm_translation: Rava said: We also learned a Mishnah, one says "with three" and one says "with five" - their testimony is nullified. And why? Say that this one knows in two leap years and this one does not know in two leap years? Rather, it is not so, because he knew the majority!

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם אֵימָא לָךְ: בְּרוּבָּה נָמֵי לָא יָדַע, וּבְשִׁיפּוּרָא יָדַע. בְּחַד שִׁיפּוּרָא אָמַר דְּטָעֵי, בִּתְרֵי שִׁיפּוּרֵי לָא אָמַר דְּטָעֵי.
human_translation: Actually, I say to you not know even once the majority knows about the shofar [ ubeshipura ], with regard to one shofar said that he erred With regard to two shofar cannot said that he erred.
llm_translation: Always say to you: In the majority of cases, he does not know, but in the minority of cases, he knows. In one case he said that it is pure, in two cases he did not say that it is pure.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי אַחָא בַּר חֲנִינָא אָמַר רַב אַסִּי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: עַד כַּמָּה מְבָרְכִין עַל הַחֹדֶשׁ? עַד שֶׁתִּתְמַלֵּא פְּגִימָתָהּ. וְכַמָּה? אָמַר רַב יַעֲקֹב בַּר אִידִי אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: עַד שִׁבְעָה. נְהַרְדָּעֵי אָמְרִי: עַד שִׁשָּׁה עָשָׂר.
human_translation: Rabbi Aḥa bar Ḥanina says Rav Asi says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Until how many one recite a blessing on the month, Until the flaw of the is filled, And how many Rav Ya’akov bar Idi says Rav Yehuda says: Until seven of Neharde’a say: Until sixteen
llm_translation: And Rabbi Ahah bar Hanina said in the name of Rav Assi who said in the name of Rabbi Yohanan: Until when do we bless on the new moon? Until its blemish is filled. And how much? Rav Yaakov bar Idi said in the name of Rav Yehudah: Until seven. Nehardea said: Until sixteen.

hebrew_text: וְתַרְוַיְיהוּ כְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן סְבִירָא לְהוּ: הָא לְמִיהְוֵי כִּי יִתְרָא, הָא לְמִיהְוֵי כִּי נָפְיָא.
human_translation: And they both hold in accordance with Rabbi Yoḥanan this to will be like the string That to will be like a sieve,
llm_translation: And their opinions are like Rabbi Yochanan, it seems to him: this for when it is more, this for when it is less.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַחָא מִדִּיפְתִּי לְרָבִינָא: וְלִיבָרֵיךְ ״הַטּוֹב וְהַמֵּטִיב״! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַטּוּ כִּי חָסַר מִי מְבָרְכִינַן ״דַּיַּין הָאֱמֶת״, דִּלְבָרֵיךְ ״הַטּוֹב וְהַמֵּטִיב״? וְלִיבָרְכִינְהוּ לְתַרְוַיְיהוּ? כֵּיוָן דְּהַיְינוּ אוֹרְחֵיהּ, לָא מְבָרְכִינַן.
human_translation: Rav Aḥa of Difti said to Ravina: And they should bless Who is good and Who does good, said to him: Is that to say when shrinking we bless, the true Judge, that we should bless: Who is good and Who does good, and we should say them both: Since this is its nature, we do not bless
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Acha from Difti to Ravina: "And according to your reasoning, 'the good and the beneficent'!" He said to him: "Do we not bless 'the true Judge' when we say 'the good and the beneficent'? Should we bless them both together? Since that is its way, we do not bless."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי אַחָא בַּר חֲנִינָא אָמַר רַבִּי אַסִּי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כׇּל הַמְבָרֵךְ עַל הַחֹדֶשׁ בִּזְמַנּוֹ כְּאִילּוּ מְקַבֵּל פְּנֵי שְׁכִינָה. כְּתִיב הָכָא ״הַחֹדֶשׁ הַזֶּה״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם ״זֶה אֵלִי וְאַנְוֵהוּ״. תָּנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: אִילְמָלֵא לֹא זָכוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל אֶלָּא לְהַקְבִּיל פְּנֵי אֲבִיהֶן שֶׁבַּשָּׁמַיִם כָּל חֹדֶשׁ וָחֹדֶשׁ, דַּיָּים. אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: הִלְכָּךְ נֵימְרִינְהוּ מְעוּמָּד.
human_translation: And Rabbi Aḥa bar Ḥanina says Rabbi Asi says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: anyone who blesses the month in its time, as if he greets the Face of the Divine Presence. is written here “This month and is written there, “This is my God and I will glorify Him” The school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: If the Jewish people merited to greet the Face of their Father in Heaven only each and every month, suffice for them, Abaye said: Therefore, we will say while standing,
llm_translation: And Rabbi Ahah bar Hanina said in the name of Rabbi Assi who said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: Anyone who blesses on the new moon in its proper time is as if he is receiving the presence of the Divine. It is written here "this month," and it is written there "this is my God and I will glorify Him." A teaching of the school of Rabbi Ishmael: If the people of Israel had only merited to welcome the face of their Father in heaven every month, it would be sufficient. Abaye said: Therefore, we establish them the blessings standing.

hebrew_text: מָרִימָר וּמָר זוּטְרָא מְכַתְּפִי אַהֲדָדֵי וּמְבָרְכִי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַחָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: בְּמַעְרְבָא מְבָרְכִי ״בָּרוּךְ מְחַדֵּשׁ חֳדָשִׁים״. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הַאי נְשֵׁי דִּידַן נָמֵי מְבָרְכִי.
human_translation: Mareimar and Mar Zutra would lean on one another’s shoulders and recite the blessing. Rav Aḥa said to Rav Ashi: In the West, they recite blessing Blessed is He Who renews the months. said to him: Our women also recite that blessing,
llm_translation: Marimar and Mar Zutra would lean on each other's shoulders and bless the congregation. Rav Acha said to Rav Ashi: In the West, they bless with "Blessed is He who renews the months." He said to him: Our women also bless in this manner.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא כִּדְרַב יְהוּדָה, דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: ״בָּרוּךְ [וְכוּ׳] אֲשֶׁר בְּמַאֲמָרוֹ בָּרָא שְׁחָקֵים, וּבְרוּחַ פִּיו כׇּל צְבָאָם. חֹק וּזְמַן נָתַן לָהֶם שֶׁלֹּא יְשַׁנּוּ אֶת תַּפְקִידָם, שָׂשִׂים וּשְׂמֵחִים לַעֲשׂוֹת רְצוֹן קוֹנָם. פּוֹעֲלֵי אֱמֶת שֶׁפְּעוּלָּתָן אֱמֶת. וְלַלְּבָנָה אָמַר שֶׁתִּתְחַדֵּשׁ עֲטֶרֶת תִּפְאֶרֶת לַעֲמוּסֵי בָטֶן, שֶׁהֵן עֲתִידִין לְהִתְחַדֵּשׁ כְּמוֹתָהּ וּלְפָאֵר לְיוֹצְרָם עַל שֵׁם כְּבוֹד מַלְכוּתוֹ. בָּרוּךְ אַתָּה ה׳ מְחַדֵּשׁ חֳדָשִׁים״.
human_translation: Rather, is of Rav Yehuda. As Rav Yehuda says: Blessed Who by His word created the heavens, and by the breath of his mouth all their hosts. He set for them a law and a time, that they should not deviate from their task. And they are joyous and glad to perform the will of their Owner; they are workers of truth whose work is truth. And to the moon He said that it should renew a crown of beauty for those He carried from the womb, as they are destined to be renewed like it, and to praise their Creator for the name of His glorious kingdom. Blessed are You the Lord, Who renews the months.
llm_translation: Rather, like Rav Yehudah, for Rav Yehudah said: "Blessed and so forth is He who, with His word, created the heavens, and with the breath of His mouth, all their hosts. He gave them a law and a time, that they should not deviate from their appointed task, joyful and happy to do the will of their Creator. The doers of truth, their work is truth. And to the moon He said that it should renew itself as a crown of glory for those who were weary in the womb, for they are destined to be renewed like it, and to glorify their Creator in the name of the glory of His kingdom. Blessed are You, Hashem, who renews the months."

hebrew_text: כִּי בְתַחְבֻּלוֹת תַּעֲשֶׂה לְּךָ מִלְחָמָה. אָמַר רַבִּי אַחָא בַּר חֲנִינָא אָמַר רַבִּי אַסִּי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: בְּמִי אַתָּה מוֹצֵא מִלְחַמְתָּהּ שֶׁל תּוֹרָה? בְּמִי שֶׁיֵּשׁ בְּיָדוֹ חֲבִילוֹת שֶׁל מִשְׁנָה. קָרֵי רַב יוֹסֵף אַנַּפְשֵׁיהּ: ״וְרׇב תְּבוּאוֹת בְּכֹחַ שׁוֹר״.
human_translation: “For by wise advice you shall make your war” Rabbi Aḥa bar Ḥanina says Rabbi Asi says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: In whom do you find the war, of Torah? In one who has in his possession bundles, of Mishna. Rav Yosef would read concerning himself “And much produce comes by the strength of the ox”
llm_translation: In strategies you shall make for yourself war. Rabbi Ahah bar Hanina said, Rabbi Assi said, Rabbi Yohanan said: With whom do you wage her war of Torah? With one who has in his hand bundles of Mishnah. Rav Yosef himself called out: "And abundant produce is through the strength of an ox."

hebrew_text: אֶחָד אוֹמֵר בִּשְׁתֵּי שָׁעוֹת כּוּ׳. אָמַר רַב שִׁימִי בַּר אָשֵׁי: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא שָׁעוֹת, אֲבָל אֶחָד אוֹמֵר קוֹדֶם הָנֵץ הַחַמָּה וְאֶחָד אוֹמֵר לְאַחַר הָנֵץ הַחַמָּה – עֵדוּתָן בְּטֵילָה.
human_translation: one says at two hours, Rav Shimi bar Ashi says: taught only hours, but one says before the sunrise, and one says after the sunrise, their testimony is void.
llm_translation: One says "within two hours." Rav Shimi bar Ashei said: They only disagreed regarding hours, but one says before sunrise and one says after sunrise - their testimony is nullified.

hebrew_text: פְּשִׁיטָא! אֶלָּא: אֶחָד אוֹמֵר ״קוֹדֶם הָנֵץ״, וְאֶחָד אוֹמֵר ״בְּתוֹךְ הָנֵץ״. הָא נָמֵי פְּשִׁיטָא! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: הָא בְּגִילּוּיָא קָאֵי, וְזַהֲרוּרֵי בְּעָלְמָא הוּא דַּחֲזָא – קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: obvious? Rather, one says before the sunrise, and one says during the sunrise, this also obvious? Lest you say this was standing in an exposed and saw a mere shine teaches us
llm_translation: It is obvious! Rather, one says "before sunrise," and one says "at sunrise." Is it really obvious? Perhaps one stands in the revealed light, and it is the clarity of the world that he sees - this is what he is informing us.

hebrew_text: וְאַחַר כָּךְ מַכְנִיסִין כּוּ׳. אוֹתוֹ הַיּוֹם וְתוּ לָא? וְהָתַנְיָא: אִם יֵשׁ מַמָּשׁ בִּדְבָרָיו – לֹא הָיָה יוֹרֵד מִשָּׁם לְעוֹלָם, וְאִם אֵין מַמָּשׁ בִּדְבָרָיו – אֵין יוֹרֵד כׇּל הַיּוֹם כּוּלּוֹ, כְּדֵי שֶׁלֹּא תְּהֵא עֲלִיָּיתוֹ יְרִידָה לוֹ. אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: תַּרְגּוּמַהּ אַאִם אֵין מַמָּשׁ בִּדְבָרָיו.
human_translation: And afterward they bring in That day and no more? But isn’t it taught If statement of has substance he would never descend from there, But if statement of does not have substance, he would not descend from there the entire day, in order that his ascent should not be a descent for him, Abaye said: Interpret with regard to statement of does not have substance.
llm_translation: And afterwards they bring in the "ku". Is that day and the next day? And it was taught: If there is substance in his words - he would never descend from there forever, and if there is no substance in his words - he does not descend the entire day, in order that his ascent not be a descent for him. Abaye said: Translate it, but if there is no substance in his words.

hebrew_text: מָצְאוּ לוֹ זְכוּת כּוּ׳. יַיִן מַאי טַעְמָא לָא? אָמַר רַבִּי אַחָא בַּר חֲנִינָא: אָמַר קְרָא ״וּלְרוֹזְנִים אֵי שֵׁכָר״ – הָעוֹסְקִין בְּרָזוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם אַל יִשְׁתַּכְּרוּ.
human_translation: found acquit What is the reason not wine? Rabbi Aḥa bar Ḥanina says the verse states: nor for princes [ rozenim ] to say: Where is strong drink” those who deal with the secret of the world [ berazo shel olam ], Do not become drunk.
llm_translation: They found for him merit. Wine, what is the reason that it is not? Rabbi Ahah bar Hanina said: Scripture says, "And for princes, and for strong drink" - those who are engaged in the secrets of the world should not become intoxicated.

hebrew_text: מָצְאוּ לוֹ זְכוּת כּוּ׳. לֹא רָאוּ, מַאי?
human_translation: found acquit him do not see what
llm_translation: They found for him merit. They did not see, what?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אַחָא: פּוֹטְרִין אוֹתוֹ. וְכֵן אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: פּוֹטְרִין אוֹתוֹ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב פָּפָּא לְאַבָּיֵי: וְלִיפְטְרֵיהּ מֵעִיקָּרָא! אָמַר לֵיהּ: הָכִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כְּדֵי שֶׁלֹּא יֵצְאוּ מִבֵּית דִּין מְעוּרְבָּבִין.
human_translation: Rabbi Aḥa says: They release him, And likewise Rabbi Yoḥanan says: They release him. Rav Pappa said to Abaye: But they should release him from the outset? said to him: This Rabbi Yoḥanan said: so that they not leave the court confounded,
llm_translation: Rabbi Ahah said: They exempt him. And so said Rabbi Yohanan: They exempt him. Rav Papa said to Abbaye: And to exempt him from the outset! He said to him: Thus said Rabbi Yohanan: So that the courts do not become mixed.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב פָּפָּא לְאַבָּיֵי, וּלְמָה לִי יוֹסִיפוּ? לִיפְטְרֵיהּ מִבֵּי דִּינָא קַמָּא! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי קָאֵי כְּוָותָךְ, דְּתַנְיָא: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר, כְּשֵׁם שֶׁאֵין מוֹסִיפִין עַל בֵּית דִּין שֶׁל שִׁבְעִים וְאֶחָד, כָּךְ אֵין מוֹסִיפִין עַל בֵּית דִּין שֶׁל עֶשְׂרִים וּשְׁלֹשָׁה.
human_translation: Some say Rav Pappa said to Abaye: But why do I them to add they should release him from the first court? said to him: Rabbi Yosei holds in accordance with your as it is taught Rabbi Yosei says: Just as does not add to a court of seventy-one, so too, does not add to a court of twenty-three.
llm_translation: There are those who say: Rav Papa said to Abbaye, "And why should they add to it? To exempt him from the first court!" He said to him: "Rabbi Yosei stands by your side, as it was taught: Rabbi Yosei says, just as they do not add to the court of seventy-one, so too they do not add to the court of twenty-three."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אוֹמֵר בְּדִינֵי מָמוֹנוֹת ״נִזְדַּקֵּן הַדִּין״, וְאֵין אוֹמֵר בְּדִינֵי נְפָשׁוֹת ״נִזְדַּקֵּן הַדִּין״.
human_translation: The Sages taught: In monetary law says: The judgment has grown aged, but in capital law does not say: The judgment has grown aged.
llm_translation: The sages taught: In cases of monetary matters, "the law becomes clarified," but in cases of capital offenses, "the law does not become clarified."

hebrew_text: מַאי ״נִזְדַּקֵּן הַדִּין״? אִילֵּימָא קַשׁ דִּינָא, אִיפְּכָא מִיבַּעְיָא לֵיהּ! אָמַר רַב הוּנָא בַּר מָנוֹחַ מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִיקָא: אֵיפוֹךְ. רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: לְעוֹלָם לָא תֵּיפוֹךְ, וּמַאי ״נִזְדַּקֵּן הַדִּין״ – חֲכַם דִּינָא.
human_translation: What The judgment has grown aged? If we say The judgment aged, he should the reverse, Rav Huna bar Manoaḥ said in the name of Rav Aḥa, son of Rav Ika: Reverse Rav Ashi said: Actually, do not reverse And what The judgment has grown aged? the judgment wise,
llm_translation: What is "the judgment is established"? If you say it is a difficult judgment, the opposite is required of it! Rav Huna son of Manoah said in the name of Rav Acha son of Ika: Reverse it. Rav Ashi said: One should never reverse it. And what is "the judgment is established"? - A wise judge.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: גָּדוֹל שֶׁבַּדַּיָּינִין אוֹמֵר ״נִזְדַּקֵּן הַדִּין״. אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא חֲכַם דִּינָא, הַיְינוּ דְּאָמַר גָּדוֹל. אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ קַשׁ דִּינָא, לָא סַגִּיא דְּלָא אָמַר גָּדוֹל? כַּסּוֹפֵי הוּא דְּקָא מְיכַסֵּיף נַפְשֵׁיהּ?
human_translation: raises an objection the greatest among the judges says: The judgment has grown aged. Granted, if you say The judgment wise, this that the greatest says But if you say The judgment aged, is it not enough that the greatest not say Must he humiliate himself
llm_translation: The question was raised: The greatest among the judges says, "The judgment has been clarified." If you say it refers to a wise judge, that is why he said "great." But if you say it refers to a harsh judge, is it not excessive that he did not say "great"? Perhaps it is at the end that he is causing harm to himself?

hebrew_text: אִין. אֵינוֹ דּוֹמֶה מִתְבַּיֵּישׁ מֵעַצְמוֹ, לְמִתְבַּיֵּישׁ מֵאֲחֵרִים.
human_translation: Yes, Being shamed by oneself is not comparable to being shamed by others.
llm_translation: There is. He is not similar to be ashamed from himself, to be ashamed from others.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא קַשׁ דִּינָא, הַיְינוּ דְּאֵינוֹ דּוֹמֶה מִתְבַּיֵּישׁ מֵעַצְמוֹ לְמִתְבַּיֵּישׁ מֵאֲחֵרִים. אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ חֲכַם דִּינָא, גָּדוֹל אַשְׁבּוֹחֵי מַשְׁבַּח נַפְשֵׁיהּ? וְהָכְתִיב: ״יְהַלֶּלְךָ זָר וְלֹא פִיךָ״!
human_translation: Some say Granted, if you say The judgment aged, this because being shamed by oneself is not comparable to being shamed by others. But if you say The judgment wise, the greatest praise himself? But isn’t it written: “Let another man praise you, and not your own mouth,
llm_translation: There are those who say: If you say the judgment is difficult, that is because he is not embarrassed of himself to be embarrassed of others. Rather, if you say the judge is wise, should the praisers of his soul be great? And it is written: "A stranger will praise you, and not your own mouth"!

hebrew_text: שָׁאנֵי מִילְּתָא דְּבֵי דִינָא, דְּאַגָּדוֹל רַמְיָא. כְּדִתְנַן: גָּמְרוּ אֶת הַדָּבָר, הָיוּ מַכְנִיסִין אוֹתָן. גָּדוֹל שֶׁבַּדַּיָּינִין אוֹמֵר: ״אִישׁ פְּלוֹנִי אַתָּה זַכַּאי״, ״אִישׁ פְּלוֹנִי אַתָּה חַיָּיב״.
human_translation: A matter of the court is different, as incumbent upon the greatest As we learned When they finished the matter, they would bring in The greatest of the judges say: So-and-so, you are exempt So-and-so, you are liable
llm_translation: The matter of the court is different, for the great one hints. As we learned: Once they concluded the matter, they would bring them in. The greatest among the judges would say, "You are acquitted, so-and-so," "You are liable, so-and-so."

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָיךְ הָיוּ בּוֹדְקִין
llm_translation: We will return to you, they were examining.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ נִגְמַר הַדִּין , מוֹצִיאִין אוֹתוֹ לְסוֹקְלוֹ. בֵּית הַסְּקִילָה הָיָה חוּץ לְבֵית דִּין, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הוֹצֵא אֶת הַמְקַלֵּל״.
human_translation: the trial has ended he is taken out to be stoned. The place of stoning was outside the court as it is stated “Take out him who has cursed
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: When the judgment is concluded, they take him out to stone him. The place of stoning was outside the court, as it is stated: "Take out the one who cursed."

hebrew_text: אֶחָד עוֹמֵד עַל פֶּתַח בֵּית דִּין, וְהַסּוּדָרִין בְּיָדוֹ, וְסוּס רָחוֹק מִמֶּנּוּ כְּדֵי שֶׁיְּהֵא רוֹאֵהוּ. אוֹמֵר אֶחָד: ״יֵשׁ לְלַמֵּד עָלָיו זְכוּת״, הַלָּה מֵנִיף בְּסוּדָרִין, וְהַסּוּס רָץ וּמַעֲמִידָן. וַאֲפִילּוּ הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״יֵשׁ לִי לְלַמֵּד עַל עַצְמִי זְכוּת״, מַחֲזִירִין אוֹתוֹ, אֲפִילּוּ אַרְבַּע וְחָמֵשׁ פְּעָמִים, וּבִלְבַד שֶׁיֵּשׁ מַמָּשׁ בִּדְבָרָיו.
human_translation: One stands at the entrance to the court, with cloths [ vehasudarin ] in his hand, and a horse at a distance from him where he can see him. one says: can teach acquit him, the other, waves the cloths and the horse races and stops them, And even he, says: I can teach acquit myself, he is returned even four or five times, provided that there is substance to his words.
llm_translation: One stands at the entrance of the court, with the documents in his hand, and a horse is far away from him so that he can see it. One says: "There is merit to teach in his favor," the other waves the documents, and the horse runs and stops. And even if he says, "I have merit to teach in my own favor," they return him, even four or five times, as long as there is substance in his words.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ וּבֵית הַסְּקִילָה חוּץ לְבֵית דִּין הֲוָה, וְתוּ לָא? וְהָא תַּנְיָא: בֵּית הַסְּקִילָה הָיָה חוּץ לְשָׁלֹשׁ מַחֲנוֹת.
human_translation: And was the place of stoning outside the court and nothing more? But isn’t it taught The place of stoning was outside three camps
llm_translation: Gemara: And the place of stoning was outside the court, is it so? But it was taught: The place of stoning was outside the three camps.

hebrew_text: אִין, כִּדְקָאָמְרַתְּ. וְהָא דְּקָתָנֵי הָכִי, נָפְקָא מִינַּהּ דְּאִי נָפֵיק בֵּי דִינָא וְיָתֵיב חוּץ לְשָׁלֹשׁ מַחֲנוֹת, עָבְדִינַן בֵּית הַסְּקִילָה חוּץ לְבֵית דִּין, כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלָא מִיתְחֲזֵי בֵּית דִּין רוֹצְחִין. אִי נָמֵי, כִּי הֵיכִי דְּתִיהְוֵי לֵיהּ הַצָּלָה.
human_translation: Yes, as you said, And difference that teaches this that if the court went out and convened outside three camps, the place of stoning is set up from the court, so that should not appear to be a court of killers. Alternatively, so that might have saved,
llm_translation: The text states: "Ein, as you said. And this that it teaches thus, it is derived from it that if one goes out from the court and sits outside of the three camps, we perform the stoning outside of the court, so that the murderers are not seen by the court. Alternatively, so that there will be a rescue for him."

hebrew_text: מְנָהָנֵי מִילֵּי? דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״הוֹצֵא אֶת הַמְקַלֵּל אֶל מִחוּץ לַמַּחֲנֶה״ – חוּץ לְשָׁלֹשׁ מַחֲנוֹת. אַתָּה אוֹמֵר חוּץ לְשָׁלֹשׁ מַחֲנוֹת, אוֹ אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא חוּץ לְמַחֲנֶה אַחַת? נֶאֱמַר כָּאן ״מִחוּץ לַמַּחֲנֶה״, וְנֶאֱמַר בְּפָרִים הַנִּשְׂרָפִין ״חוּץ לְמַחֲנֶה״. מָה לְהַלָּן – חוּץ לְשָׁלֹשׁ מַחֲנוֹת, אַף כָּאן – חוּץ לְשָׁלֹשׁ מַחֲנוֹת.
human_translation: From where is this matter As the Sages taught “Take out him who has cursed to outside the camp” Outside three camps, you say outside three camps, or outside only one camp? It is stated here “outside the camp” and it is stated with regard to the bulls that are burned “outside the camp” Just as there, outside three camps, so too here, outside three camps.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: What are the particulars? For the Rabbis taught: "Take the one who cursed outside the camp" - outside of the three camps. Do you say outside of the three camps, or is it only outside of one camp? It is stated here "outside the camp," and it is stated regarding the burnt heifers "outside the camp." Just as there - outside of the three camps, so too here - outside of the three camps.

hebrew_text: וְהָתָם מְנָלַן? דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״וְהוֹצִיא אֶת כׇּל הַפָּר אֶל מִחוּץ לַמַּחֲנֶה״ – חוּץ לְשָׁלֹשׁ מַחֲנוֹת. אַתָּה אוֹמֵר חוּץ לְשָׁלֹשׁ מַחֲנוֹת, אוֹ אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא חוּץ לְמַחֲנֶה אַחַת?
human_translation: And there, from where do we As the Sages taught “Even the whole bull shall he carry outside the camp outside three camps. Do you say outside three camps, or outside only one camp?
llm_translation: And there, how do we derive it? For the Rabbis taught: "And he shall bring out the entire bull to outside the camp" - outside of three camps. Do you say outside of three camps, or is it only outside of one camp?

hebrew_text: כְּשֶׁהוּא אוֹמֵר ״אֶל מִחוּץ לַמַּחֲנֶה״ בְּפַר הָעֵדָה, שֶׁאֵין תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר, שֶׁהֲרֵי כְּבָר נֶאֱמַר ״וְשָׂרַף אֹתוֹ כַּאֲשֶׁר שָׂרַף אֵת הַפָּר הָרִאשׁוֹן״ – לִיתֵּן לוֹ מַחֲנֶה שְׁנִיָּה.
human_translation: When states with regard to the bull a communal outside the camp, as no the verse to state since it is already stated “And burn it as he burned the first bull,” To give it a second camp,
llm_translation: When he says "outside the camp" regarding the Red Heifer, there is no need for the Talmud to say, for it has already been stated, "And he shall burn it as he burned the first heifer" - to give it a second camp.

hebrew_text: וּכְשֶׁהוּא אוֹמֵר ״אַל מִחוּץ לַמַּחֲנֶה״ בְּדֶשֶׁן, שֶׁאֵין תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר, שֶׁהֲרֵי כְּבָר נֶאֱמַר ״עַל שֶׁפֶךְ הַדֶּשֶׁן יִשָּׂרֵף״ – לִיתֵּן לוֹ מַחֲנֶה שְׁלִישִׁית.
human_translation: And when states with regard to the ash: outside the camp as no the verse to state since it is already stated where the ashes are poured out to give it a third camp,
llm_translation: And when he says, "Do not burn it outside the camp" regarding the ashes, there is no need for the Talmud to say, as it has already been stated, "It shall be burned on the ash heap." - to give it the status of a third camp.

hebrew_text: וְלֵילַף מִשְּׁחוּטֵי חוּץ? מָה לְהַלָּן חוּץ לְמַחֲנֶה אַחַת, אַף כָּאן חוּץ לְמַחֲנֶה אַחַת.
human_translation: should be learned from offerings slaughtered outside Just as there, Outside one camp, so too here, outside one camp.
llm_translation: And Leilaf from the outside slaughter? What is there outside to one camp, so too here outside to one camp.

hebrew_text: מִסְתַּבְּרָא, מִפָּרִים הַנִּשְׂרָפִין הֲוָה לֵיהּ לְמֵילַף,
human_translation: reasonable to derive from bulls that are burned.
llm_translation: He reasoned, from the fruits the seraphim had for him to eat.

hebrew_text: שֶׁכֵּן ״הוֹצֵא אֶל מִחוּץ לַמַּחֲנֶה״, מַכְשִׁיר וּמְכַפֵּר.
human_translation: As “Take out [ hotze ] to outside the camp,” renders fit, And atone
llm_translation: "So too, 'Take him outside the camp,' renders him fit and atones."

hebrew_text: אַדְּרַבָּה, מִשְּׁחוּטֵי חוּץ הֲוָה לֵיהּ לְמֵילַף,
human_translation: On the contrary, should be derived from offerings slaughtered outside
llm_translation: Ad Ravva, mishchutei chutz havah lei l'meilaf.

hebrew_text: שֶׁכֵּן אָדָם חוֹטֵא, בִּנְשָׁמָה, פִּיגּוּל.
human_translation: As a person a sin, with souls, disqualification of an offering that was sacrificed with the intent to consume it after its designated time [ piggul ]
llm_translation: So too, a person sins, in the soul, pigul.

hebrew_text: מַכְשִׁיר מִמַּכְשִׁיר עֲדִיף לֵיהּ.
human_translation: prefers render fit render fit,
llm_translation: Fit from fit is preferable.

hebrew_text: רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר: מֹשֶׁה הֵיכָא הֲוָה יָתֵיב? בְּמַחֲנֵה לְוִיָּיה. וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ רַחֲמָנָא: ״הוֹצֵא אֶת הַמְקַלֵּל אֶל מִחוּץ לַמַּחֲנֶה״ – חוּץ לְמַחֲנֵה לְוִיָּיה. ״וַיּוֹצִיאוּ אֶת הַמְקַלֵּל אֶל מִחוּץ לַמַּחֲנֶה״ – חוּץ לְמַחֲנֵה יִשְׂרָאֵל.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: Where was Moses sitting In the Levite camp, And the Merciful One said to “Take out him who has cursed to outside the camp,” outside the Levite camp and they brought him that had cursed out of the camp, outside the Israelite camp
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: Where was Moses sitting? In the camp of the Levites. And the Merciful One said to him: "Take the one who cursed outside the camp" - outside the camp of the Levites. "And they took the one who cursed outside the camp" - outside the camp of Israel.

hebrew_text: הַאי מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לַעֲשִׂיָּיה? עֲשִׂיָּיה בְּהֶדְיָא כְּתִיבָא:
human_translation: This is necessary about the implementation The implementation is written explicitly,
llm_translation: This one requires for him to do it? To do it with his hand, as it is written:

hebrew_text: ״וּבְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל עָשׂוּ כַּאֲשֶׁר צִוָּה ה׳ אֶת מֹשֶׁה״.
human_translation: “And the children of Israel did as the Lord commanded Moses.”
llm_translation: "And the children of Israel did as the Lord commanded Moses."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה: ״וַיִּרְגְּמוּ אֹתוֹ אָבֶן״ מַאי עָבְדִי לֵיהּ? הָהוּא מִבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְכִדְתַנְיָא: ״וַיִּרְגְּמוּ אֹתוֹ בָּאָבֶן״ – ״אֹתוֹ״ וְלֹא בִּכְסוּתוֹ, ״אָבֶן״ שֶׁאִם מֵת בְּאֶבֶן אַחַת יָצָא.
human_translation: If that is so, what do they do with “And they stoned him with a stone”? That necessary for that which is taught “And they stoned him with a stone.” “him” but not in his clothing. “stone [ aven ]” that if died with one stone, fulfilled
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rather from now on: "And they stoned him with stones" - what did they do to him? That one wanted to fulfill what is taught: "And they stoned him with a stone" - "him" and not his clothing, "stone" so that if he dies with one stone, he fulfills his obligation.

hebrew_text: וְאִצְטְרִיךְ לְמִיכְתַּב ״אָבֶן״, וְאִיצְטְרִיךְ לְמִיכְתַּב ״אֲבָנִים״. דְּאִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״אָבֶן״, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: הֵיכָא דְּלָא מֵת בַּחֲדָא, לָא נַיְתֵי אַחֲרִיתִי וְנִיקְטְלֵיהּ. כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״אֲבָנִים״. וְאִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״אֲבָנִים״, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: מֵעִיקָּרָא נַיְיתֵי תַּרְתֵּי. כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״אָבֶן״.
human_translation: And was necessary to write a stone,” and was necessary to write stones” As, had the Merciful One written “stone,” I would say where did not die with one they do not bring other and kill him the Merciful One writes “stones.” And had the Merciful One written “stones,” I would say from the outset they should bring two the Merciful One writes “stone.”
llm_translation: The text requires the word "stone" to be written, and it requires the word "stones" to be written. For if the Merciful One had written "stone," I would say: where one did not die, another does not come afterwards and kill him. The Merciful One wrote "stones." And if the Merciful One had written "stones," I would say: initially, two come. The Merciful One wrote "stone."

hebrew_text: וְהָא הַאי תַּנָּא ״נֶאֱמַר״ קָאָמַר? ״אִילּוּ לֹא נֶאֱמַר״ קָאָמַר, וְהָכִי קָאָמַר: אִילּוּ לֹא נֶאֱמַר קְרָא, הָיִיתִי אוֹמֵר גְּזֵירָה שָׁוָה. עַכְשָׁיו שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר קְרָא, גְּזֵירָה שָׁוָה לָא צְרִיךְ.
human_translation: But this tanna said: It is stated said: Had it not been stated, and this is saying: Had a verse not been stated I would have said a verbal analogy. now that a verse has been stated, verbal analogy is not needed.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: And this, this Tanna, "it is said" is saying? "If it were not said" is saying, and thus is saying: If it were not said in the verse, I would say it is an equal decree. Now that it is said in the verse, an equal decree is not necessary.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: מֹשֶׁה הֵיכָא הֲוָה יָתֵיב? בְּמַחֲנֵה לְוִיָּיה. וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ רַחֲמָנָא: ״הוֹצֵא אֶת הַמְקַלֵּל״ – חוּץ לְמַחֲנֵה לְוִיָּיה. ״אֶל מִחוּץ לַמַּחֲנֶה״ – חוּץ לְמַחֲנֵה יִשְׂרָאֵל. ״וַיּוֹצִיאוּ אֶת הַמְקַלֵּל״ – לַעֲשִׂיָּיה.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: Where was Moses sitting In the Levite camp. And the Merciful One said to him: “Take out him who has cursed” outside the Levite camp “Outside the camp,” outside the Israelite camp. “And they brought him that had cursed about the implementation
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: Where was Moses sitting? In the camp of the Levites. And the Merciful One said to him: "Take out the one who cursed" - outside the camp of the Levites. "Outside the camp" - outside the camp of Israel. "And they took out the one who cursed" - to his execution.
