hebrew_text: עֲשִׂיָּיה בְּהֶדְיָא כְּתִיב בְּהוּ: ״וּבְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל עָשׂוּ כַּאֲשֶׁר צִוָּה ה׳ אֶת מֹשֶׁה״. הָהוּא מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ, חַד לִסְמִיכָה וְחַד לִדְחִיָּיה.
human_translation: The implementation written explicitly in this “And the children of Israel did as the Lord commanded Moses.” That is necessary to the placing hands and to the pushing
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "Asiya beHadya k'tiv beHu: 'uvenei Yisrael asu ka'asher tzivah Hashem et Moshe.' hahu mib'eilei lei, chad lis'micha v'chad lidchiya." English translation: "Regarding the making of the Hadya, it is written: 'And the children of Israel did as the Lord commanded Moses.' He needed it for both juxtaposition and refutation."

hebrew_text: אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ רַבָּנַן לְרַב אָשֵׁי: לְדִידָךְ, כֹּל הָנֵי ״הוֹצִיא״ דִּכְתִיבִי בְּפָרִים הַנִּשְׂרָפִים, מַאי דָּרְשַׁתְּ בְּהוּ? קַשְׁיָא.
human_translation: The Sages said to Rav Ashi: According to you, what do you learn from all those “take out” that are written with regard to the bulls that are burned? difficult
llm_translation: The sages said to Rav Ashi: According to your opinion, all these "brought out" that are written in the burnt heifers, what do you expound with them? It is difficult.

hebrew_text: אֶחָד עוֹמֵד כּוּ׳. אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: פְּשִׁיטָא לִי, אֶחָד אֶבֶן שֶׁנִּסְקָל בָּהּ, וְאֶחָד עֵץ שֶׁנִּתְלֶה בּוֹ, וְאֶחָד סַיִיף שֶׁנֶּהֱרָג בּוֹ, וְאֶחָד סוּדָר שֶׁנֶּחְנָק בּוֹ – כּוּלָּן מִשֶּׁל צִבּוּר. מַאי טַעְמָא? דְּמִדִּידֵיהּ לָא אָמְרִינַן לֵיהּ: ״זִיל וְלֵיתֵיהּ וְלִיקְטוֹל נַפְשֵׁיהּ״.
human_translation: one stands Rav Huna says: obvious to me the stone with which is stoned and the tree on which is hung or the sword with which he is killed, or the scarf with which he is strangled, all of these from the community. What is the reason We do not tell go and bring from his own and kill himself.
llm_translation: One stands and says. Rav Huna said: It is obvious to me, one stone that was stoned with it, and one wood that was hanged on it, and one sword that was killed with it, and one garment that was choked with it - all of them are considered public property. What is the reason? Because we do not say to its owner: "Go and let him die."

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רַב הוּנָא: סוּדָר שֶׁמְּנִיפִין בּוֹ, וְסוּס שֶׁרָץ וּמַעֲמִידָן – מִשֶּׁל מִי הוּא? כֵּיוָן דְּהַצָּלָה דִּידֵיהּ, מִדִּידֵיהּ הוּא? אוֹ דִילְמָא, כֵּיוָן דְּבֵי דִּינָא מְחַיְּיבִין לְמֶעְבַּד לֵיהּ הַצָּלָה, מִדִּידְהוּ?
human_translation: Rav Huna raised the cloth that is waved and the horse that races to stop from whose do they come, Since save from his Or perhaps, since the court is obligated to save him from them,
llm_translation: Ba'ei Rav Huna: Sudar shem'nifin bo, ve'sus she'rachatz u'ma'amidan - mishel mi hu? Keivan de'hatzalah didaihu, mi'didaihu hu? O dilma, keivan de'bei dinah mechayvin l'me'bad lei hatzalah, mi'didhu?

hebrew_text: וְתוּ, הָא דְּאָמַר רַב חִיָּיא בַּר רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: הַיּוֹצֵא לֵיהָרֵג מַשְׁקִין אוֹתוֹ קוֹרֶט שֶׁל לְבוֹנָה בְּכוֹס שֶׁל יַיִן כְּדֵי שֶׁתִּטָּרֵף דַּעְתּוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״תְּנוּ שֵׁכָר לְאוֹבֵד וְיַיִן לְמָרֵי נָפֶשׁ״. וְתַנְיָא: נָשִׁים יְקָרוֹת שֶׁבִּירוּשָׁלַיִם הָיוּ מִתְנַדְּבוֹת וּמְבִיאוֹת אוֹתָן. לֹא הִתְנַדְּבוּ נָשִׁים יְקָרוֹת, מִשֶּׁל מִי? הָא וַדַּאי מִסְתַּבְּרָא מִשֶּׁל צִבּוּר, כֵּיוָן דִּכְתִיב ״תְּנוּ״ – מִדִּידְהוּ.
human_translation: And furthermore, that which Rav Ḥiyya bar Ashi says Rav Ḥisda says: gives one who is being led out to be killed a grain [ koret ] of frankincense in a cup of wine in order to confuse his mind as it is stated: “Give strong drink to him that is ready to perish, and wine to the bitter in soul” And it is taught The prominent women of Jerusalem would donate and bring these prominent women did not donate from whom this is certainly reasonable from the community, as it is written: “Give [ tenu ] from them,
llm_translation: And come, this that said Rav Chiya bar Rav Ashe said Rav Chisda: One who is taken out to be executed, they give him a mixture of frankincense in a cup of wine in order to confuse his mind, as it is stated: "Give strong drink to one perishing, and wine to the bitter in soul." And it was taught: The noble women of Jerusalem would donate and bring them. The noble women did not donate, from whose property? This certainly makes sense from communal funds, since it is written "Give" – from their own.

hebrew_text: בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ רַב אַחָא בַּר הוּנָא מֵרַב שֵׁשֶׁת: אָמַר אֶחָד מִן הַתַּלְמִידִים ״יֵשׁ לִי לְלַמֵּד עָלָיו זְכוּת״, וְנִשְׁתַּתֵּק, מַהוּ? מְנַפַּח רַב שֵׁשֶׁת בִּידֵיהּ. נִשְׁתַּתֵּק? אֲפִילּוּ אֶחָד בְּסוֹף הָעוֹלָם נָמֵי! הָתָם לָא קָאָמַר, הָכָא קָאָמַר. מַאי?
human_translation: Rav Aḥa bar Huna asked Rav Sheshet: one of the students said: I can teach acquit him, and he became mute what is Rav Sheshet waved his hands became mute, even someone at the end of the world There, no one said Here, said What
llm_translation: Requested from him Rav Aḥa bar Huna from Rav Sheishet: Said one of the disciples, "I have to teach merit upon him," and he was cut off. What is the law? Rav Sheishet was blowing in his hands. Was he cut off? Even one at the end of the world is trustworthy! There, he did not say, here he said. What is the law?

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר חֲנִינָא: אֶחָד מִן הַתַּלְמִידִים שֶׁזִּיכָּה וָמֵת, רוֹאִין אוֹתוֹ כְּאִילּוּ חַי וְעוֹמֵד בִּמְקוֹמוֹ. זִיכָּה – אִין, לֹא זִיכָּה – לָא.
human_translation: Come hear As Rabbi Yosei bar Ḥanina says: one of the students who acquit and died, views him as if alive and standing in his place he acquit yes, he did not acquit not
llm_translation: Come and hear, for Rabbi Yosei bar Hanina said: If one of the disciples was acquitted and died, they see him as if he is alive and standing in his place. Acquitted - yes, not acquitted - no.

hebrew_text: זִיכָּה – פְּשִׁיטָא לִי; אָמַר – תִּיבְּעֵי לָךְ.
human_translation: argued acquit obvious to me says let the dilemma be raised
llm_translation: "Zikah - peshita li; amar - tibbeei lakh."

hebrew_text: אֲפִילּוּ הוּא כּוּ׳. וַאֲפִילּוּ פַּעַם רִאשׁוֹנָה וּשְׁנִיָּה? וְהָתַנְיָא: פַּעַם רִאשׁוֹנָה וּשְׁנִיָּה, בֵּין שֶׁיֵּשׁ מַמָּשׁ בִּדְבָרָיו בֵּין שֶׁאֵין מַמָּשׁ בִּדְבָרָיו – מַחְזִירִין אוֹתוֹ. מִכָּאן וָאֵילָךְ, אִם יֵשׁ מַמָּשׁ בִּדְבָרָיו – מַחְזִירִין אוֹתוֹ, אֵין מַמָּשׁ בִּדְבָרָיו – אֵין מַחְזִירִין אוֹתוֹ.
human_translation: even he, And even the first and second time But isn’t it taught The first and second times they return him whether there is substance to his statement or there is no substance to his statement. From this forward, if there is substance to his statement they return him there is no substance to his statement, they do not return him.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Even if he is like so. And even the first and second time? And it was taught: The first and second time, whether there is substance in his words or there is no substance in his words - they return him. From here on, if there is substance in his words - they return him, if there is no substance in his words - they do not return him.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: תַּרְגּוּמַהּ מִפַּעַם שְׁנִיָּה וְאֵילָךְ.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: Explain from the second time forward,
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: Its translation is from the second time and onwards.

hebrew_text: מְנָא יָדְעִי? אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: דְּמָסְרִינַן לֵיהּ זוּגָא דְּרַבָּנַן. אִי אִיכָּא מַמָּשׁ בִּדְבָרָיו – אִין, אִי לָא – לָא.
human_translation: How do we know Abaye said: we send a pair of rabbis with him If there is substance to his statement, yes, if not, not
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Mena yadai? Amar Abbayei: Demasrinan lei zuga deRabanan. Iy ikka mamash bidvarav - ein, iy lo - lo." English translation: "How do I know? Abbayei said: We hand over to him the pair of Rabbis. If there is substance in his words - yes, if not - no."

hebrew_text: וְלִימְסַר לֵיהּ מֵעִיקָּרָא? אַגַּב דִּבְעִית, לָא מָצֵי אָמַר כֹּל מַאי דְּאִית לֵיהּ.
human_translation: But send with him from the outset, Since is frightened he is not able to say all that he has
llm_translation: And to deliver it from the outset? Because you desired, it cannot be said everything that it has.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מָצְאוּ לוֹ זְכוּת – פְּטָרוּהוּ, וְאִם לָאו – יוֹצֵא לִיסָּקֵל. וְכָרוֹז יוֹצֵא לְפָנָיו: ״אִישׁ פְּלוֹנִי בֶּן פְּלוֹנִי יוֹצֵא לִיסָּקֵל עַל שֶׁעָבַר עֲבֵירָה פְּלוֹנִית, וּפְלוֹנִי וּפְלוֹנִי עֵדָיו. כׇּל מִי שֶׁיּוֹדֵעַ לוֹ זְכוּת יָבֹא וִילַמֵּד עָלָיו״.
human_translation: find acquit him, they release him But if not he goes out to be stoned. And a crier goes out before him So-and-so, son of so-and-so, is going out to be stoned because he committed such and such a transgression. And so-and-so and so-and-so are his witnesses. Anyone who knows acquit him should come and teach on his behalf.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If they found merit for him - they exempt him, but if not - he is led out to be stoned. And a herald goes out before him and proclaims: "So-and-so, son of so-and-so, is led out to be stoned for having committed a specific transgression, and so-and-so and so-and-so are his witnesses. Whoever knows of his merit, let him come and testify on his behalf."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: וְצָרִיךְ לְמֵימַר בְּיוֹם פְּלוֹנִי, וּבְשָׁעָה פְּלוֹנִית, וּבְמָקוֹם פְּלוֹנִי. דִּילְמָא אִיכָּא דְּיָדַעי וְאָתֵי וּמַזֵּים לְהוּ.
human_translation: Abaye says: And must proclaim on such and such a day, at such and such an hour, and at such and such a place, perhaps there are those who know and they will come and render conspiring witnesses.
llm_translation: Gemara said Abaye: And needs to say on day so-and-so, and at hour so-and-so, and in place so-and-so. Perhaps there is someone who knows and comes and informs them.

hebrew_text: וְכָרוֹז יוֹצֵא לְפָנָיו. לְפָנָיו – אִין, מֵעִיקָּרָא – לָא. וְהָתַנְיָא: בְּעֶרֶב הַפֶּסַח תְּלָאוּהוּ לְיֵשׁוּ הַנּוֹצְרִי, וְהַכָּרוֹז יוֹצֵא לְפָנָיו אַרְבָּעִים יוֹם: ״יֵשׁוּ הַנּוֹצְרִי יוֹצֵא לִיסָּקֵל עַל שֶׁכִּישֵּׁף וְהֵסִית וְהִדִּיחַ אֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל. כׇּל מִי שֶׁיּוֹדֵעַ לוֹ זְכוּת יָבוֹא וִילַמֵּד עָלָיו״. וְלֹא מָצְאוּ לוֹ זְכוּת, וּתְלָאוּהוּ בְּעֶרֶב הַפֶּסַח.
human_translation: a crier goes out before before him, yes, from the outset, not But isn’t it taught On Passover Eve they hung Jesus the Nazarene And a crier went out before him forty days, Jesus the Nazarene is going out to be stoned because he practiced sorcery, incited and led the Jewish people astray. Anyone who knows acquit him should come and teach on his behalf. And did not find acquit him, and they hung his on Passover eve.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And a proclamation goes out before him. Before him - yes, from the outset - no. And it was taught: On the eve of Passover they hanged Yeshu the Nazarene, and a proclamation went out before him for forty days: "Yeshu the Nazarene is going out to be stoned because he practiced sorcery and enticed and led Israel astray. Anyone who knows of his innocence should come forward and teach about it." But they did not find his innocence, so they hanged him on the eve of Passover.

hebrew_text: אָמַר עוּלָּא: וְתִסְבְּרָא? יֵשׁוּ הַנּוֹצְרִי בַּר הַפּוֹכֵי זְכוּת הוּא? מֵסִית הוּא, וְרַחֲמָנָא אָמַר: ״לֹא תַחְמֹל וְלֹא תְכַסֶּה עָלָיו!״ אֶלָּא שָׁאנֵי יֵשׁוּ, דְּקָרוֹב לְמַלְכוּת הֲוָה.
human_translation: Ulla said: And you understand Jesus the Nazarene worthy of a search acquit He an inciter and the Merciful One states “Neither shall you spare, neither shall you conceal him” Rather, Jesus was different, as he close with the government,
llm_translation: Ulla said: And was Yeshu the Nazarene a son of the Pukhé? Is he deserving of merit? He is a seducer, and the Merciful One said: "Do not spare him, and do not cover for him!" Rather, Yeshu was different, for he was close to the kingdom.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: חֲמִשָּׁה תַּלְמִידִים הָיוּ לוֹ לְיֵשׁוּ הַנּוֹצְרִי – מַתַּאי, נַקַּאי, נֶצֶר, וּבוּנִי, וְתוֹדָה. אַתְיוּהּ לְמַתַּי. אֲמַר לְהוּ: מַתַּי יֵהָרֵג? הָכְתִיב ״מַתַּי אָבוֹא וְאֵרָאֶה פְּנֵי אֱלֹהִים״? אָמְרוּ לוֹ: אִין, מַתַּי יֵהָרֵג, דִּכְתִיב: ״מָתַי יָמוּת וְאָבַד שְׁמוֹ״.
human_translation: the Sages taught: Jesus the Nazarene had five disciples: Mattai, Nakai, Netzer, Buni, and Toda. They brought Mattai in said to Shall Mattai be executed? isn’t it written: “When [ matai ] shall I come and appear before God?” They said to him: Yes, Mattai shall be executed, as it is written: “When [ matai ] shall he die, and his name perish?”
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: There were five disciples of Jesus the Nazarene - Mattai, Nakai, Netzer, Buni, and Todah. Mattai was brought before the court. He said to them: Shall Mattai be put to death? Is it not written, "When will I come and see the face of God"? They said to him: No, Mattai shall be put to death, as it is written, "When will he die and his name perish?"

hebrew_text: אַתְיוּהּ לְנַקַּאי. אֲמַר לְהוּ: נַקַּאי יֵהָרֵג? הָכְתִיב ״וְנָקִי וְצַדִּיק אַל תַּהֲרֹג״? אָמְרוּ לוֹ: אִין, נַקַּאי יֵהָרֵג, דִּכְתִיב: ״בַּמִּסְתָּרִים יַהֲרֹג נָקִי״.
human_translation: they brought Nakai in said Shall Nakai be executed? isn’t it written: “And the innocent [ naki ] and righteous you shall not slay” They said to him: Yes, Nakai shall be executed, as it is written: “In secret places he kills the innocent [ naki ]”
llm_translation: He came to Nakai. He said to them: Nakai will be killed? It is written, "And innocent and righteous, do not kill"? They said to him: Yes, Nakai will be killed, as it is written, "In secret places he will kill the innocent."

hebrew_text: אַתְיוּהּ לְנֶצֶר. אָמַר: נֶצֶר יֵהָרֵג? הָכְתִיב ״וְנֵצֶר מִשׇּׁרָשָׁיו יִפְרֶה״? אָמְרוּ לוֹ: אִין, נֶצֶר יֵהָרֵג, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְאַתָּה הׇשְׁלַכְתָּ מִקִּבְרְךָ כְּנֵצֶר נִתְעָב״.
human_translation: they brought Netzer in He said Shall Netzer be executed? isn’t it written: “And a branch [ netzer ] shall grow out of his roots” They said to him: Yes, Netzer shall be executed, as it is written: “But you are cast out of your grave like an abhorred branch [ netzer ]”
llm_translation: He is coming to Nazareth. He said: Will the Nazarene be killed? Is it not written, "And a shoot shall spring forth from his roots"? They said to him: No, the Nazarene will be killed, as it is written, "But you have cast off and rejected, you have been angry with your anointed one."

hebrew_text: אַתְיוּהּ לְבוּנִי. אָמַר: בּוּנִי יֵהָרֵג? הָכְתִיב ״בְּנִי בְכֹרִי יִשְׂרָאֵל״! אָמְרוּ לוֹ: אִין, בּוּנִי יֵהָרֵג, דִּכְתִיב: ״הִנֵּה אָנֹכִי הוֹרֵג אֶת בִּנְךָ בְּכֹרֶךָ״.
human_translation: they brought Buni in said Shall Buni be executed? isn’t it written: “My firstborn son [ beni ] is Israel” They said to him: Yes, Buni shall be executed, as it is written: “Behold, I shall kill your firstborn son [ binkha ]”
llm_translation: He is coming to Buni. He said: Buni will be killed? It is written, "My firstborn son, Israel!" They said to him: No, Buni will be killed, as it is written, "Behold, I am killing your firstborn son."

hebrew_text: אַתְיוּהּ לְתוֹדָה. אָמַר: תּוֹדָה יֵהָרֵג? הָכְתִיב ״מִזְמוֹר לְתוֹדָה״? אָמְרוּ לוֹ: אִין, תּוֹדָה יֵהָרֵג, דִּכְתִיב: ״זֹבֵחַ תּוֹדָה יְכַבְּדָנְנִי״.
human_translation: they brought Toda in said Shall Toda be executed? isn’t it written: “A psalm of thanksgiving [ toda ]” They said to him: Yes, Toda shall be executed, as it is written: “Whoever slaughters a thanks-offering [ toda ] honors Me”
llm_translation: He came for a thanksgiving offering. He said: Will a thanksgiving offering be killed? Isn't it written "A psalm for thanksgiving"? They said to him: No, a thanksgiving offering will not be killed, as it is written: "He who sacrifices thanksgiving honors Me."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: כׇּל הַזּוֹבֵחַ אֶת יִצְרוֹ וּמִתְוַדֶּה עָלָיו, מַעֲלֶה עָלָיו הַכָּתוּב כְּאִילּוּ כִּיבְּדוֹ לְהַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא בִּשְׁנֵי עוֹלָמִים – הָעוֹלָם הַזֶּה וְהָעוֹלָם הַבָּא, דִּכְתִיב: ״זֹבֵחַ תּוֹדָה יְכַבְּדָנְנִי״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi says: anyone who slaughters his inclination and confesses the verse ascribes him as though he had honored the Holy One, Blessed be He, in two worlds, this world and the World-to-Come, as it is written: “Whoever slaughters a thanks-offering [ toda ] honors Me [ yekhabdaneni ]”
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: Anyone who sacrifices his evil inclination and confesses over it, the Scripture regards him as if he had offered a sacrifice to the Holy One, blessed be He, in both worlds - this world and the world to come, as it is written: "He who sacrifices thanksgiving honors Me."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: בִּזְמַן שֶׁבֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ קַיָּים, אָדָם מַקְרִיב עוֹלָה – שְׂכַר עוֹלָה בְּיָדוֹ, מִנְחָה – שְׂכַר מִנְחָה בְּיָדוֹ. אֲבָל מִי שֶׁדַּעְתּוֹ שְׁפָלָה, מַעֲלֶה עָלָיו הַכָּתוּב כְּאִילּוּ הִקְרִיב כׇּל הַקָּרְבָּנוֹת כּוּלָּן, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״זִבְחֵי אֱלֹהִים רוּחַ נִשְׁבָּרָה״. וְלֹא עוֹד, אֶלָּא שֶׁאֵין תְּפִלָּתוֹ נִמְאֶסֶת, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לֵב נִשְׁבָּר וְנִדְכֶּה אֱלֹהִים לֹא תִבְזֶה״.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi says: When the Temple is standing, a person sacrifices a burnt-offering, he has the reward for a burnt-offering, a meal-offering, he has the reward for a meal-offering. But one whose spirit is humble, the verse ascribes him as though he has sacrificed all the offerings, as it is stated: “The offerings of God are a broken spirit” And moreover, his prayer is not rejected, as it is stated “A broken and contrite heart, God, You will not despise.”
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: When the Temple is standing, a person brings an olah offering - the reward of the olah is in his hand, a mincha offering - the reward of the mincha is in his hand. But one whose knowledge is lowly, the Scripture accounts it to him as if he offered all the offerings, as it is said: "The sacrifices of God are a broken spirit." And not only that, but his prayer is not despised, as it is said: "A broken and contrite heart, O God, You will not despise."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הָיָה רָחוֹק מִבֵּית הַסְּקִילָה כְּעֶשֶׂר אַמּוֹת, אוֹמְרִים לוֹ: ״הִתְוַדֵּה״, שֶׁכֵּן דֶּרֶךְ כׇּל הַמּוּמָתִין מִתְוַדִּין. שֶׁכׇּל הַמִּתְוַדֶּה יֵשׁ לוֹ חֵלֶק לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא, שֶׁכֵּן מָצִינוּ בְּעָכָן שֶׁאָמַר לוֹ יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: ״בְּנִי שִׂים נָא כָבוֹד לַה׳ אֱלֹהֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל וְתֶן לוֹ תוֹדָה״. ״וַיַּעַן עָכָן אֶת יְהוֹשֻׁעַ וַיֹּאמַר אׇמְנָה אָנֹכִי חָטָאתִי וְכָזֹאת וְכָזֹאת וְגוֹ׳״. וּמִנַּיִן שֶׁכִּיפֵּר לוֹ וִידּוּיוֹ? שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיֹּאמֶר יְהוֹשֻׁעַ מֶה עֲכַרְתָּנוּ יַעְכֳּרְךָ ה׳ בַּיּוֹם הַזֶּה״. בְּיוֹם הַזֶּה אַתָּה עָכוּר, וְאִי אַתָּה עָכוּר לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא.
human_translation: When is at a distance of about ten cubits from the place of stoning, they say to him: Confess as the way of all who are being executed is to confess. As whoever confesses has a portion in the World-to-Come. For so we find with regard to Achan, that Joshua said to him: “My son, please give glory to the Lord, God of Israel, and make confession to Him” “And Achan answered Joshua, and said: Indeed I have sinned against the Lord, God of Israel, and like this and like that And from where that confession achieved atonement for him? as it is stated: “And Joshua said: Why have you brought trouble on us? The Lord shall trouble you this day” On this day you are troubled, but you will not be troubled in the World-to-Come.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If one was distant from the place of stoning by ten cubits, they say to him, "Confess," for this is the way of all those who are blemished to confess. Anyone who confesses has a share in the World to Come, as we find with Achan, to whom Joshua said, "My son, give, I pray thee, glory to the Lord, the God of Israel, and make confession unto Him." "And Achan answered Joshua, and said, 'Indeed I have sinned against the Lord, the God of Israel, and thus and thus have I done.'" From where do we know that he atoned for him and his confession? As it is said: "And Joshua said: 'Why have you troubled us? The Lord will trouble you this day.'" On this day you are troubled, but you will not be troubled in the World to Come.

hebrew_text: וְאִם אֵינוֹ יוֹדֵעַ לְהִתְוַודּוֹת, אוֹמְרִים לוֹ, אֱמוֹר: ״תְּהֵא מִיתָתִי כַּפָּרָה עַל כׇּל עֲוֹנוֹתַי״. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אִם הָיָה יוֹדֵעַ שֶׁהוּא מְזוּמָּם, אוֹמֵר: ״תְּהֵא מִיתָתִי כַּפָּרָה עַל כׇּל עֲוֹנוֹתַי חוּץ מֵעָוֹן זֶה״. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: אִם כֵּן, יְהוּ כׇּל אָדָם אוֹמְרִין כֵּן כְּדֵי לְנַקּוֹת עַצְמָן.
human_translation: And if does not know how to confess, they say to him: Say Let my death be an atonement for all my sins. Rabbi Yehuda says: If knows that he was convicted by the testimony of conspiring witnesses, he says: Let my death be an atonement for all my sins except for this sin. said to him: If so, every person will say that, to clear himself
llm_translation: And if he does not know to confess, they say to him, say: "Let my death be an atonement for all my sins." Rabbi Yehuda says: If he knew that he was plotted against, he says: "Let my death be an atonement for all my sins except for this sin." They said to him: If so, then everyone should say so in order to cleanse themselves.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״נָא״ – אֵין ״נָא״ אֶלָּא לְשׁוֹן בַּקָּשָׁה.
human_translation: The Sages taught “Please [ na ] “ na ” is nothing other than an expression of supplication.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: "na" - "na" is only a language of difficulty.

hebrew_text: בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁאָמַר הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לִיהוֹשֻׁעַ: ״חָטָא יִשְׂרָאֵל״, אָמַר לְפָנָיו: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם, מִי חָטָא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: וְכִי דֵּילָטוֹר אֲנִי? לֵךְ הַפֵּל גּוֹרָלוֹת. הָלַךְ וְהִפִּיל גּוֹרָלוֹת, וְנָפַל הַגּוֹרָל עַל עָכָן. אָמַר לוֹ: יְהוֹשֻׁעַ, בְּגוֹרָל אַתָּה בָּא עָלַי? אַתָּה וְאֶלְעָזָר הַכֹּהֵן שְׁנֵי גְּדוֹלֵי הַדּוֹר אַתֶּם. אִם אֲנִי מַפִּיל עֲלֵיכֶם גּוֹרָל, עַל אֶחָד מִכֶּם הוּא נוֹפֵל. אָמַר לוֹ: בְּבַקָּשָׁה מִמְּךָ, אַל תּוֹצִיא לַעַז עַל הַגּוֹרָלוֹת, שֶׁעֲתִידָה אֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁתִּתְחַלֵּק בְּגוֹרָל, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אַךְ בְּגוֹרָל יֵחָלֵק אֶת הָאָרֶץ״.
human_translation: When the Holy One, Blessed be He, said to Joshua: “Israel has sinned” said to Him: Master of the Universe, who sinned? said to him: Am I an informer [ deilator ]? Go cast lots went and cast lots, and the lot fell upon Achan. said to him: Joshua, do you come to me based on a lot, You and Elazar the priest are the two distinguished of the generation, if I cast a lot upon you, it will fall upon one of you. said to him: I ask of you, do not spread slander about the lots, as Eretz Yisrael will be divided by lots, as it is stated: “Nevertheless, the land shall be divided by lot”
llm_translation: In the hour that the Holy One, blessed be He, said to Joshua, "Israel has sinned," he said before Him: Master of the Universe, who has sinned? He said to him: Am I a teller of tales? Go and cast lots. He went and cast lots, and the lot fell upon Achan. He said to him: Joshua, have you come to me by lot? You and Eleazar the High Priest are the two great ones of the generation. If I cast lots upon you, it is upon one of you that it will fall. He said to him: Please, I beg of you, do not bring guilt upon Eleazar through the lots, for the land of Israel is destined to be divided by lot, as it is said: "But by lot shall the land be divided."

hebrew_text: ״תֵּן תּוֹדָה״. אָמַר רָבִינָא, שַׁחוֹדֵי שַׁחֲדֵיהּ בְּמִילֵּי: כְּלוּם נְבַקֵּשׁ מִמְּךָ אֶלָּא הוֹדָאָה? תֵּן לוֹ תּוֹדָה וְהִיפָּטֵר. מִיָּד: ״וַיַּעַן עָכָן אֶת יְהוֹשֻׁעַ וַיֹּאמַר אׇמְנָה אָנֹכִי חָטָאתִי לַה׳ אֱלֹהֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל וְכָזֹאת וְכָזֹאת עָשִׂיתִי״.
human_translation: make confession Ravina says: won over with words, Do we ask anything of you but a confession? Make confession to Him and be discharged. immediately “And Achan answered Joshua, and said: Indeed I have sinned against the Lord, God of Israel, and like this and like that have I done”
llm_translation: "Give thanks." Ravina said, the briber of his bribe in words: Are we seeking nothing from you except acknowledgment? Give him thanks and be acquitted. Immediately: "And Achan answered Joshua and said, 'Truly, I have sinned against the Lord, the God of Israel, and this is what I did.'"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אַסִּי אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: מְלַמֵּד שֶׁמָּעַל עָכָן בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה חֲרָמִים, שְׁנַיִם בִּימֵי מֹשֶׁה וְאֶחָד בִּימֵי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כָּזֹאת וְכָזֹאת עָשִׂיתִי״. רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: חֲמִשָּׁה, אַרְבָּעָה בִּימֵי מֹשֶׁה וְאֶחָד בִּימֵי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אָנֹכִי חָטָאתִי וְכָזֹאת וְכָזֹאת עָשִׂיתִי״.
human_translation: Rav Asi says Rabbi Ḥanina says: This teaches that Achan misused three dedications, Two in the days of Moses, and one in the days of Joshua, as it is stated: like this and like that have I done,” Rabbi Yoḥanan says in the name of Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon: five four in the days of Moses, and one in the days of Joshua, as it is stated: “I have sinned and like this and like that have I done,”
llm_translation: Rav Assi said, Rabbi Chanina said: It teaches that Achan committed a trespass with three cherems, two in the days of Moses and one in the days of Joshua, as it is stated: "So have I done this and that." Rabbi Yochanan said in the name of Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Shimon: Five, four in the days of Moses and one in the days of Joshua, as it is stated: "I have sinned, and thus and thus have I done."

hebrew_text: וְעַד הַשְׁתָּא, מַאי טַעְמָא לָא אִיעֲנוּשׁ? אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: לְפִי שֶׁלֹּא עָנַשׁ עַל הַנִּסְתָּרוֹת עַד שֶׁעָבְרוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל אֶת הַיַּרְדֵּן.
human_translation: what is the reason that were not punished until now? Rabbi Yoḥanan says in the name of Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon: Because did not punish for hidden until the Jewish people crossed the Jordan
llm_translation: Until now, what is the reason why they were not punished? Rabbi Yochanan said in the name of Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Shimon: Because punishment is not imposed for hidden sins until the Israelites crossed the Jordan.

hebrew_text: כְּתַנָּאֵי: ״הַנִּסְתָּרֹת לַה׳ אֱלֹהֵינוּ וְהַנִּגְלֹת לָנוּ וּלְבָנֵינוּ עַד עוֹלָם״. לָמָּה נָקוּד עַל ״לָנוּ וּלְבָנֵינוּ״ וְעַל עַיִן שֶׁבְּ״עַד״? מְלַמֵּד שֶׁלֹּא עָנַשׁ עַל הַנִּסְתָּרוֹת עַד שֶׁעָבְרוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל אֶת הַיַּרְדֵּן, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: subject to tanna’im . “The hidden matters belong to the Lord our God, but those matters that are revealed belong to us and to our children forever [ ad olam ], Why are there dots over “to us and to our children” and over the ayin in “forever [ ad ]”? teach that did not punish for hidden until the Jewish people crossed the Jordan the statement of Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: Tannaim: "The hidden things belong to the Lord our God, but the revealed things are for us and our children forever." Why is there a dot over "for us and our children" and over the letter Ayin in "forever"? It teaches that one is not punished for hidden things until the Israelites crossed the Jordan, the words of Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה: וְכִי עָנַשׁ עַל הַנִּסְתָּרוֹת לְעוֹלָם? וַהֲלֹא כְּבָר נֶאֱמַר ״עַד עוֹלָם״! אֶלָּא, כְּשֵׁם שֶׁלֹּא עָנַשׁ עַל הַנִּסְתָּרוֹת, כָּךְ לֹא עָנַשׁ עַל עוֹנָשִׁין שֶׁבַּגָּלוּי עַד שֶׁעָבְרוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל אֶת הַיַּרְדֵּן. אֶלָּא
human_translation: Rabbi Neḥemya said to him: And does ever punish for hidden But isn’t it already stated: God…forever,” Rather, just as did not punish for hidden so He did not punish for until the Jewish people crossed the Jordan But
llm_translation: He said to him Rabbi Nechemiah: Is one punished for hidden sins forever? Has it not already been said "forever"! Rather, just as one is not punished for hidden sins, so too one is not punished for sins that are revealed until the Israelites crossed the Jordan. Instead

hebrew_text: עָכָן, מַאי טַעְמָא אִיעֲנוּשׁ? מִשּׁוּם דַּהֲווֹ יָדְעִי בֵּיהּ אִשְׁתּוֹ וּבָנָיו.
human_translation: what is the reason Achan they were punished? because his wife and children knew about it,
llm_translation: Achan, what is the reason for his punishment? Because he knew about it, his wife and his sons.

hebrew_text: ״חָטָא יִשְׂרָאֵל״. אָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא בַּר זַבְדָּא: אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁחָטָא, יִשְׂרָאֵל הוּא. אָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא: הַיְינוּ דְּאָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי: אָסָא דְּקָאֵי בֵּינֵי חִלְפֵי, אָסָא שְׁמֵיהּ, וְאָסָא קָרוּ לֵיהּ.
human_translation: “Israel has sinned” Rabbi Abba bar Zavda says: even when have sinned, they are “Israel.” Rabbi Abba says: This that people say: a myrtle is found among thorns, its name is myrtle and call it myrtle.
llm_translation: "חָטָא יִשְׂרָאֵל". Rabbi Abba bar Zavda said: Even though he sinned, he is still Israel. Rabbi Abba said: This is like what people say: Asa who stands between halves, his name is Asa, and they call him Asa.

hebrew_text: ״וְגַם עָבְרוּ אֶת בְּרִיתִי אֲשֶׁר צִוִּיתִי אוֹתָם גַּם לָקְחוּ מִן הַחֵרֶם גַּם גָּנְבוּ גַּם כִּחֲשׁוּ גַּם שָׂמוּ בִּכְלֵיהֶם״. אָמַר רַבִּי אִילְעָא מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בַּר מַסְפַּרְתָּא: מְלַמֵּד שֶׁעָבַר עָכָן עַל חֲמִשָּׁה חוּמְשֵׁי תוֹרָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר חֲמִשָּׁה ״גַּם״.
human_translation: “They have also transgressed My covenant which I commanded them, and they have also taken of the dedicated property, and also stolen, and also dissembled, and also put it among their own goods.” Rabbi Ile’a says in the name of Rabbi Yehuda bar Masparta: teaches that Achan transgressed five books of the Torah, as “also” is stated five
llm_translation: "And they have also transgressed My covenant which I commanded them; they have even taken of the devoted things, and have also stolen, and have also dissembled, and have also put it among their own stuff." Rabbi Ilai said in the name of Rabbi Yehuda bar Masparta: This teaches that Achan transgressed on five fifths of the Torah, as it is stated 'five' 'also'."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי אִילְעָא מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בַּר מַסְפַּרְתָּא: עָכָן מוֹשֵׁךְ בְּעׇרְלָתוֹ הָיָה. כְּתִיב הָכָא ״וְגַם עָבְרוּ אֶת בְּרִיתִי״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם ״אֶת בְּרִיתִי הֵפַר״.
human_translation: And Rabbi Ile’a says in the name of Rabbi Yehuda bar Masparta: Achan, would stretch his foreskin Here, it is written: “They have also transgressed My covenant,” and there, it is written: “He has violated My covenant”
llm_translation: And Rabbi Ilai said in the name of Rabbi Yehuda bar Masparta: Achan was holding onto his foreskin. It is written here, "And they also transgressed My covenant," and it is written there, "He broke My covenant."

hebrew_text: פְּשִׁיטָא! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: בְּמִצְוָה גּוּפֵיהּ לָא פְּקַר? קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: obvious Lest you say with regard to a mitzva his own body, he did not act irreverently, teaches us
llm_translation: It is obvious! What might you say: in a commandment itself is it not free? It is teaching us.

hebrew_text: וְכִי עָשָׂה נְבָלָה בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל. אָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא בַּר זַבְדָּא: מְלַמֵּד שֶׁבָּעַל עָכָן נַעֲרָה הַמְאוֹרָסָה. כְּתִיב הָכָא ״וְכִי עָשָׂה נְבָלָה״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם ״כִּי עָשְׂתָה נְבָלָה בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל״.
human_translation: “And because he has committed a wanton deed in Israel” Rabbi Abba bar Zavda says: teaches that engaged in sexual intercourse with a betrothed young woman. Here, it is written: “And because he has committed a wanton deed,” and there, it is written: “Because she has committed a wanton deed in Israel,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And did he commit a disgraceful act in Israel." Rabbi Abba bar Zavda said: This teaches that Achan had relations with a betrothed maiden. It is written here, "And did he commit a disgraceful act," and it is written there, "For he committed a disgraceful act in Israel."

hebrew_text: פְּשִׁיטָא! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא כּוּלֵּי הַאי לָא פְּקַר נַפְשֵׁיהּ, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן. רָבִינָא אָמַר: דִּינֵיהּ כְּנַעֲרָה הַמְאוֹרָסָה, דְּבִסְקִילָה.
human_translation: obvious, Lest you say he did not act irreverently to such an extent, teaches us Ravina said: his punishment like a betrothed young woman which by stoning.
llm_translation: It is obvious! What might you say, that all of this is not considered self-defense, it is evident to us. Ravina said: Its laws are like a betrothed maiden who was raped.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רֵישׁ גָּלוּתָא לְרַב הוּנָא: כְּתִיב: ״וַיִּקַּח יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אֶת עָכָן בֶּן זֶרַח וְאֶת הַכֶּסֶף וְאֶת הָאַדֶּרֶת וְאֶת לְשׁוֹן הַזָּהָב וְאֶת בָּנָיו וְאֶת בְּנֹתָיו וְאֶת שׁוֹרוֹ וְאֶת חֲמֹרוֹ וְאֶת צֹאנוֹ וְאֶת אׇהֳלוֹ וְאֶת כׇּל אֲשֶׁר לוֹ״. אִם הוּא חָטָא, בָּנָיו וּבְנוֹתָיו מֶה חָטְאוּ?
human_translation: The Exilarch said to Rav Huna: It is written: “And Joshua took Achan, son of Zerah, and the silver, and the mantle, and the wedge of gold, and his sons, and his daughters, and his oxen, and his asses, and his sheep, and his tent, and all that he had, If sinned, did his sons and daughters sin,
llm_translation: He said to him, the head of the exile, to Rav Huna: It is written: "And Joshua took Achan son of Zerah, and the silver, and the cloak, and the bar of gold, and his sons, and his daughters, and his ox, and his donkey, and his sheep, and his tent, and all that he had." If he sinned, what did his sons and daughters sin?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: וְלִיטַעְמָיךְ, אִם הוּא חָטָא – כָּל יִשְׂרָאֵל מֶה חָטְאוּ? דִּכְתִיב: ״וְכׇל יִשְׂרָאֵל עִמּוֹ״. אֶלָּא לִרְדּוֹתָן. הָכִי נָמֵי, כְּדֵי לִרְדּוֹתָן.
human_translation: said to And according to your reasoning if sinned, did all of Israel sin? As it is written: “And all Israel with him.” Rather, to chastise them So too, in order to chastise them.
llm_translation: He said to him: And for your taste, if he sinned - all Israel, what did they sin? As it is written: "And all Israel with him." Rather, to make them descend. So too, in order to make them descend.

hebrew_text: ״וַיִּשְׂרְפוּ אֹתָם בָּאֵשׁ וַיִּסְקְלוּ אֹתָם בָּאֲבָנִים״. בְּתַרְתֵּי? אָמַר רָבִינָא: הָרָאוּי לִשְׂרֵיפָה – לִשְׂרֵיפָה, הָרָאוּי לִסְקִילָה – לִסְקִילָה.
human_translation: “And they burned them with fire, and stoned them with stones.” with two Ravina says: That which was fit for burning, for burning, that which was fit for stoning, for stoning.
llm_translation: "And they burned them with fire and stoned them." In two? Rabinah said: One deserving of burning – with burning, one deserving of stoning – with stoning.

hebrew_text: ״וָאֵרֶא בַשָּׁלָל אַדֶּרֶת שִׁנְעָר אַחַת טוֹבָה וּמָאתַיִם שְׁקָלִים כֶּסֶף״. רַב אָמַר: אִיצְטְלָא דְּמֵילָתָא, וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: סַרְבָּלָא דִּצְרִיפָא.
human_translation: “And I saw among the spoil a fine mantle of Shinar, and two hundred shekels of silver” Rav says: a cloak [ itztela ] of wool [ demeilta ], and Shmuel says: a garment [ sarbela ] dyed with alum.
llm_translation: "And I saw among the spoil a beautiful cloak, and two hundred shekels of silver." Rav said: 'A cloak of fine wool,' and Shmuel said: 'A woven cloak.'

hebrew_text: ״וַיַּצִּיקוּם לִפְנֵי ה׳״. אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: בָּא וַחֲבָטָם לִפְנֵי הַמָּקוֹם. אָמַר לְפָנָיו: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם, עַל אֵלּוּ תֵּיהָרֵג רוּבָּהּ שֶׁל סַנְהֶדְרִין? דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיַּכּוּ מֵהֶם אַנְשֵׁי הָעַי כִּשְׁלֹשִׁים וְשִׁשָּׁה אִישׁ״. וְתַנְיָא: שְׁלֹשִׁים וְשִׁשָּׁה מַמָּשׁ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה. אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה: וְכִי שְׁלֹשִׁים וְשִׁשָּׁה הָיוּ? וַהֲלֹא לֹא נֶאֱמַר אֶלָּא ״כִּשְׁלֹשִׁים וְשִׁשָּׁה אִישׁ״! אֶלָּא זֶה יָאִיר בֶּן מְנַשֶּׁה שֶׁשָּׁקוּל כְּנֶגֶד רוּבָּהּ שֶׁל סַנְהֶדְרִין.
human_translation: “And they laid them out before the Lord” Rav Naḥman says: came and cast down before God. said to Him: Master of the Universe, because of these the majority of the Sanhedrin were killed? As it is written: “And the men of Ai smote of them about thirty-six men” and it is taught Thirty-six literally, the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Neḥemya said to But were they thirty-six Didn’t it state only: “About thirty-six men”? Rather, this is Yair, son of Manasseh, who was equivalent to the majority of the Sanhedrin,
llm_translation: "They poured them out before the Lord." Rav Nachman said: He came and struck them before the Omnipresent. He said before Him: Master of the Universe, upon these shall You kill the majority of the Sanhedrin? As it is written: "And the men of Ai struck down about thirty-six men." And it was taught: Thirty-six exactly, the words of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Nechemiah said to him: Were they really thirty-six? Was it not only stated, "about thirty-six men"? Rather, this refers to Yair ben Menashe, who was equal in weight to the majority of the Sanhedrin.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַב: מַאי דִּכְתִיב ״תַּחֲנוּנִים יְדַבֶּר רָשׁ וְעָשִׁיר יַעֲנֶה עַזּוֹת״? ״תַּחֲנוּנִים יְדַבֵּר רָשׁ״ – זֶה מֹשֶׁה, ״וְעָשִׁיר יַעֲנֶה עַזּוֹת״ – זֶה יְהוֹשֻׁעַ.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman says that Rav says: What which is written: “The poor man speaks entreaties, but the rich man answers with impudence” “The poor man speaks entreaties”; this Moses, “But the rich man answers with impudence”; this Joshua,
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said in the name of Rav: What is the meaning of what is written, "Prayers will speak the poor, and the rich will answer with strength"? "Prayers will speak the poor" - this is Moses, "and the rich will answer with strength" - this is Joshua.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא? אִילֵּימָא מִשּׁוּם דִּכְתִיב ״וַיַּצִּיקוּם לִפְנֵי ה׳״, וְאָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: בָּא וַחֲבָטָן לִפְנֵי הַמָּקוֹם. אַטּוּ פִּנְחָס לָא עֲבַד הָכִי? דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיַּעֲמֹד פִּינְחָס וַיְפַלֵּל וַתֵּעָצַר הַמַּגֵּפָה״, וְאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: ״וַיִּתְפַּלֵּל״ לֹא נֶאֱמַר אֶלָּא ״וַיְפַלֵּל״, מְלַמֵּד שֶׁעָשָׂה פְּלִילוּת עִם קוֹנוֹ. בָּא וַחֲבָטָן לִפְנֵי הַמָּקוֹם, אָמַר לְפָנָיו: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם, עַל אֵלּוּ יִפְּלוּ עֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבָּעָה אֶלֶף מִיִּשְׂרָאֵל? דִּכְתִיב: ״וְיִהְיוּ הַמֵּתִים בַּמַּגֵּפָה אַרְבָּעָה וְעֶשְׂרִים אָלֶף״.
human_translation: What is the reason If we say because it is written: “And he laid them out before the Lord,” and Rav Naḥman says came and cast down before God Is that to say Pinehas did not act the same As it is written: “Then stood up Pinehas, and executed judgment [ vayefallel ], and the plague was stayed” and Rabbi Elazar says: And he prayed [ vayitpallel ], is not stated; rather, “and he executed judgment [ vayefallel ]” teaches that he entered into a judgment with his Creator. He came and cast down before God, said to Him: Master of the Universe, because of these twenty-four thousand of the Jewish people fell? As it is written: “And those that died by the plague were twenty-four thousand”
llm_translation: What is the reason? Perhaps because it is written, "And they were presented before the Lord," and Rav Nachman said: He came and struck them before the Omnipresent. Did not Pinchas do so? As it is written: "And Pinchas stood up and prayed, and the plague was stopped," and Rabbi Elazar said: "And he prayed" is not stated, but rather "and he prayed," teaching that he argued with his Creator. He came and struck them before the Omnipresent, he said before Him: Master of the Universe, for these should twenty-four thousand of Israel fall? As it is written: "And the dead in the plague were twenty-four thousand."

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא מֵהָכָא: ״לָמָּה הֵעֲבַרְתָּ הַעֲבִיר אֶת הָעָם הַזֶּה אֶת הַיַּרְדֵּן״. מֹשֶׁה נָמֵי מֵימָר אֲמַר: ״לְמָה הֲרֵעֹתָה לָעָם הַזֶּה״. אֶלָּא מֵהָכָא: ״וְלוּ הוֹאַלְנוּ וַנֵּשֶׁב בְּעֵבֶר הַיַּרְדֵּן״.
human_translation: Rather, from this “Why have You brought this people over the Jordan” Moses also said “Why have You dealt ill with this people? Rather, from here, “Would that we had been content and had remained in the Transjordan”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And rather from here: "Why have you caused this people to pass over the Jordan?" Moshe indeed said: "Why have you brought evil upon this people." But rather from here: "If only we had been willing and had settled beyond the Jordan."

hebrew_text: ״וַיֹּאמֶר ה׳ אֶל יְהוֹשֻׁעַ קוּם לָךְ״. דָּרֵישׁ רַבִּי שֵׁילָא: אָמַר לֵיהּ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: שֶׁלְּךָ קָשָׁה מִשֶּׁלָּהֶם. אֲנִי אָמַרְתִּי ״וְהָיָה בְּעׇבְרְכֶם אֶת הַיַּרְדֵּן תָּקִימוּ״, וְאַתֶּם רִיחַקְתֶּם שִׁשִּׁים מִיל.
human_translation: “And the Lord said to Joshua: Get you up; Rabbi Sheila taught The Holy One, Blessed be He, said to Your is worse than I said “And it shall be when you have gone over the Jordan, that you shall set up and you have distanced yourselves sixty mil
llm_translation: "And Hashem said to Yehoshua, 'Arise, go.' Rabbi Sheilah expounded: The Holy One, blessed be He, said to him: Yours is more difficult than theirs. I said, 'When you have crossed over the Jordan, you shall set up.' But you have distanced yourselves sixty mil."

hebrew_text: בָּתַר דִּנְפַק, אוֹקֵים רַב אָמוֹרָא עֲלֵיהּ וּדְרַשׁ: ״כַּאֲשֶׁר צִוָּה ה׳ אֶת מֹשֶׁה עַבְדּוֹ כֵּן צִוָּה מֹשֶׁה אֶת יְהוֹשֻׁעַ וְכֵן עָשָׂה יְהוֹשֻׁעַ לֹא הֵסִיר דָּבָר מִכׇּל אֲשֶׁר צִוָּה ה׳ אֶת מֹשֶׁה״.
human_translation: After went out, Rav, placed an interpreter alongside him, and he taught: “As the Lord commanded Moses His servant, so did Moses command Joshua, and so did Joshua; he left nothing undone of all that the Lord had commanded Moses”
llm_translation: After he went out, Rav Amora established and expounded: "As the Lord commanded Moses his servant, so Moses commanded Joshua, and so Joshua did; he did not remove a thing from all that the Lord commanded Moses."

hebrew_text: אִם כֵּן, מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״קוּם לָךְ״? אָמַר לוֹ: אַתָּה גָּרַמְתָּ לָהֶם. וְהַיְינוּ דְּקָאָמַר לֵיהּ בְּעַי: ״וְעָשִׂיתָ לָעַי וּלְמַלְכָּהּ כַּאֲשֶׁר עָשִׂיתָ לִירִיחוֹ וּלְמַלְכָּהּ וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: If so, what the verse states: “Get you up,” said to You caused And this is what said to him at Ai: “And you shall do to Ai and her king as you did to Jericho and her king;
llm_translation: "If so, what does the Talmud mean by 'Arise, go'? He said to him: You caused it for them. And this is what he was saying to him: 'And you shall do to Ai and its king as you did to Jericho and its king, etc.'"

hebrew_text: ״וַיְהִי בִּהְיוֹת יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בִּירִיחוֹ וַיִּשָּׂא עֵינָיו וַיַּרְא וְגוֹ׳ וַיֹּאמֶר לֹא כִּי אֲנִי שַׂר צְבָא ה׳ עַתָּה בָאתִי [וַיִּפֹּל יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אֶל פָּנָיו אַרְצָה וַיִּשְׁתָּחוּ]״. הֵיכִי עָבֵיד הָכִי? וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אָסוּר לוֹ לְאָדָם שֶׁיִּתֵּן שָׁלוֹם לַחֲבֵירוֹ בַּלַּיְלָה, חָיְישִׁינַן שֶׁמָּא שֵׁד הוּא!
human_translation: “And it came to pass when Joshua was by Jericho that he lifted up his eyes and looked, And he said: No, but I am captain of the host of the Lord; I have now come. And Joshua fell on his face to the earth, and bowed down” How could do so, But doesn’t Rabbi Yoḥanan say: prohibited for a person to greet another at night, we are concerned that perhaps is a demon?
llm_translation: "And it was when Joshua was in Jericho, and he lifted his eyes and saw, and etc. and he said, 'No, for I am the commander of the army of the Lord; now I have come and Joshua fell on his face to the ground and prostrated himself.' How did he do this? But didn't Rabbi Yochanan say: It is forbidden for a person to greet his fellow at night, for we are concerned that perhaps it is a demon!"

hebrew_text: שָׁאנֵי הָתָם, דְּקָאָמַר לֵיהּ: ״אֲנִי שַׂר צְבָא ה׳ עַתָּה בָאתִי וְגוֹ׳״. וְדִילְמָא מְשַׁקְּרִי? גְּמִירִי דְּלָא מַפְּקִי שֵׁם שָׁמַיִם לְבַטָּלָה.
human_translation: It is different there, as said to “I am captain of the host of the Lord; I have now come.” But perhaps he was lying? is learned that do not utter the name of Heaven in vain,
llm_translation: The matter is different there, for he is saying to him: "I am the commander of the army of the Lord; now I have come, etc." But perhaps they are lying? We learn that they do not mention the name of heaven in vain.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֶמֶשׁ בִּיטַּלְתֶּם תָּמִיד שֶׁל בֵּין הָעַרְבַּיִם, וְעַכְשָׁיו בִּיטַּלְתֶּם תַּלְמוּד תּוֹרָה. עַל אֵיזֶה מֵהֶן בָּאתָ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: ״עַתָּה בָּאתִי״.
human_translation: said to Yesterday, you neglected the daily afternoon offering and now, you neglected Torah study. For which of have you come said to him: “I have now come,”
llm_translation: He said to him: "Last night you nullified the evening Tamid offering, and now you have nullified the study of Torah. For what purpose did you come?" He said to him: "I have come now."

hebrew_text: מִיָּד ״וַיָּלֶן יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בַּלַּיְלָה הַהוּא בְּתוֹךְ הָעֵמֶק״, וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מְלַמֵּד שֶׁלָּן בְּעוּמְקָהּ שֶׁל הֲלָכָה.
human_translation: immediately “And Joshua lodged that night” “into the midst of the valley [ ha’emek ]” And Rabbi Yoḥanan says: teaches that he lodged in the depth [ be’omekah ] of halakha ,
llm_translation: Immediately "And Joshua lodged that night in the midst of the valley," and Rabbi Yochanan said: It teaches us that they were in the depth of the law.

hebrew_text: אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר אִינְיָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב: גָּדוֹל תַּלְמוּד תּוֹרָה יוֹתֵר מֵהַקְרָבַת תְּמִידִין, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״עַתָּה בָאתִי״.
human_translation: Shmuel bar Unya says in the name of Rav: Torah study is greater than the sacrificing of the daily offerings, as it is stated: “I have now come,”
llm_translation: Samuel son of Inia said in the name of Rav: Great is Torah study more than the offering of the continual sacrifices, as it is stated: "Now I have come."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי לְרַב דִּימִי: הַאי קְרָא בְּמַעְרְבָא בְּמַאי מוֹקְמִיתוּ לֵיהּ: ״אַל תֵּצֵא לָרִיב מַהֵר פֶּן מַה תַּעֲשֶׂה בְּאַחֲרִיתָהּ בְּהַכְלִים אֹתְךָ רֵעֶךָ. רִיבְךָ רִיב אֶת רֵעֶךָ וְסוֹד אַחֵר אַל תְּגָל״?
human_translation: Abaye said to Rav Dimi, How do you explain this verse in the West, “Do not proceed hastily to litigation, lest you know not what to do in the end of it, when your neighbor has put you to shame. Debate your cause with your neighbor, and do not reveal the secret of another”
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye to Rav Dimi: this verse in what is its context for him: "Do not go out to quarrel hastily, lest what will you do in the end when your neighbor puts you to shame. Argue your case with your neighbor, but do not disclose another's secret."

hebrew_text: בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁאָמַר לוֹ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לִיחֶזְקֵאל: לֵךְ אֱמוֹר לָהֶם לְיִשְׂרָאֵל ״אָבִיךְ הָאֱמֹרִי וְאִמֵּךְ חִתִּית״, אָמְרָה רוּחַ פִּסְקוֹנִית לִפְנֵי הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם, אִם יָבוֹאוּ אַבְרָהָם וְשָׂרָה וְיַעַמְדוּ לְפָנֶיךָ, אַתָּה אוֹמֵר לָהֶם וּמַכְלִים אוֹתָם? ״רִיבְךָ רִיב אֶת רֵעֶךָ וְסוֹד אַחֵר אַל תְּגָל״!
human_translation: At the time that the Holy One, Blessed be He, said to Ezekiel: Go say to Israel: “Your father was an Amorite and your mother a Hittite” the spirit Paskonit, said before the Holy One, Blessed be He: Master of the Universe, were Abraham and Sarah to come and stand before You, would you speak to them and put them to shame? “Debate your cause with your neighbor, and do not reveal the secret of another”?
llm_translation: At the moment when the Holy One, blessed be He, said to Ezekiel: "Go and say to the Israelites, 'Your fathers, the Amorite, and your mother, the Hittite,'" the Divine Spirit interjected before the Holy One, blessed be He, saying: "Master of the Universe, if Abraham and Sarah were to come and stand before You, would You say to them and silence them? 'Argue your case with your neighbor, but do not disclose the secret.'"

hebrew_text: וּמִי אִית לֵיהּ רְשׁוּתָא כּוּלֵּי הַאי? אִין, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: שָׁלֹשׁ שֵׁמוֹת יֵשׁ לוֹ – פִּיסְקוֹן, אִיטְמוֹן, סִיגְרוֹן. פִּיסְקוֹן – שֶׁפּוֹסֵק דְּבָרִים כְּלַפֵּי מַעְלָה, אִיטְמוֹן – שֶׁאוֹטֵם עֲוֹנוֹתֵיהֶן שֶׁל יִשְׂרָאֵל, סִיגְרוֹן – כֵּיוָן שֶׁסּוֹגֵר שׁוּב אֵינוֹ פּוֹתֵחַ.
human_translation: But does have so much authority Yes, as Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, says: He, has three names: Piskon, Itmon, Sigron. Piskon because he splits [ sheposek ] words with on High. Itmon because he conceals [ she’otem ] the sins of the Jewish people. Sigron because once he closes [ shesoger ] no one reopens
llm_translation: And who has the authority over all this? No one, as Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Chanina said: He has three names - Pisqon, Itmon, Sigrun. Pisqon - because he decides matters according to the upper realm, Itmon - because he seals the sins of the Israelites, Sigrun - once he closes, he does not reopen.

hebrew_text: ״הֲיַעֲרֹךְ שׁוּעֲךָ לֹא בְצָר״, אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: לְעוֹלָם יַקְדִּים אָדָם תְּפִלָּה לַצָּרָה, שֶׁאִילְמָלֵא לֹא הִקְדִּים אַבְרָהָם תְּפִלָּה לַצָּרָה בֵּין בֵּית אֵל וּבֵין הָעַי, לֹא נִשְׁתַּיֵּיר מִשּׂוֹנְאֵיהֶן שֶׁל יִשְׂרָאֵל שָׂרִיד וּפָלִיט. רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר: כׇּל הַמְאַמֵּץ עַצְמוֹ בִּתְפִלָּה מִלְּמַטָּה, אֵין לוֹ צָרִים מִלְּמַעְלָה. רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: לְעוֹלָם יְבַקֵּשׁ אָדָם רַחֲמִים שֶׁיְּהוּ הַכֹּל מְאַמְּצִין אֶת כֹּחוֹ, וְאַל יְהוּ לוֹ צָרִים מִלְּמַעְלָה.
human_translation: “Had you prepared your prayers, before your troubles came” Rabbi Elazar says: A person should always offer up prayer before trouble as had Abraham not anticipated the trouble prayer between Bethel and Ai, there would have been no remnant or refugee remaining among the enemies of Israel, Reish Lakish says: Anyone who concentrates himself in prayer below will have no enemies above Rabbi Yoḥanan says: A person should always pray for mercy that all should strengthen his power and that he should have no enemies above.
llm_translation: "The arranging of your supplication should not be in a hurried manner," Rabbi Elazar said: A person should always prioritize prayer for a time of distress, for if Abraham had not prioritized prayer for the distress between Bethel and Ai, there would not have remained a remnant or survivor from the enemies of Israel. Resh Lakish said: Anyone who strengthens himself in prayer from below, he will not have enemies from above. Rabbi Yochanan said: A person should always seek mercy, so that all may strengthen their power, and he will not have enemies from above."

hebrew_text: מִנַּיִן שֶׁכִּיפֵּר לוֹ וִידּוּיוֹ וְכוּ׳? תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מִנַּיִן שֶׁכִּיפֵּר לוֹ וִידּוּיוֹ? שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיֹּאמֶר לוֹ יְהוֹשֻׁעַ מֶה עֲכַרְתָּנוּ יַעְכֳּרְךָ ה׳ הַיּוֹם הַזֶּה״. הַיּוֹם הַזֶּה אַתָּה עָכוּר, וְאִי אַתָּה עָכוּר לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא. וּכְתִיב: ״וּבְנֵי זֶרַח זִמְרִי וְאֵיתָן וְהֵימָן וְכַלְכֹּל וְדַרְדַּע כֻּלָּם חֲמִשָּׁה״. מַאי ״כּוּלָּם חֲמִשָּׁה״? כּוּלָּן חֲמִשָּׁה הֵן לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא.
human_translation: From where that confession achieved atonement for him? The Sages taught From where that confession achieved atonement As it is stated: “And Joshua said: Why have you brought trouble on us? The Lord shall trouble you this day” On this day you are troubled, but you will not be troubled in the World-to-Come. And it is written: “And the sons of Zerah were Zimri and Ethan and Heman and Calcol and Dara, five of them in all” What “five of them in all” All five are to the World-to-Come.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: From where do we derive that confession and atonement are effective for him? The Rabbis taught: From where do we derive that confession and atonement are effective for him? As it is stated: "And Joshua said to him, 'Why have you troubled us? The Lord will trouble you this day.'" On this day you are troubled, but you will not be troubled in the World to Come. And it is written: "And the sons of Zerah: Zimri, Ethan, Heman, Calcol, and Dara; all of them five." What is meant by "all of them five"? All of them are five for the World to Come.

hebrew_text: כְּתִיב ״זִמְרִי״, וּכְתִיב ״עָכָן״. רַב וּשְׁמוּאֵל: חַד אָמַר, עָכָן שְׁמוֹ, וְלָמָּה נִקְרָא שְׁמוֹ זִמְרִי? שֶׁעָשָׂה מַעֲשֵׂה זִמְרִי. וְחַד אָמַר, זִמְרִי שְׁמוֹ, וְלָמָּה נִקְרָא שְׁמוֹ עָכָן? שֶׁעִיכֵּן עֲוֹנוֹתֵיהֶן שֶׁל יִשְׂרָאֵל.
human_translation: it is written: “Zimri,” and it is written: Achan, Rav and Shmuel One says: His name was Achan. Why was he called Zimri? because he acted like Zimri, And one says: His name was Zimri. Why was he called Achan? because he acted like a snake [ she’iken ] of the sins of the Jewish people.
llm_translation: It is written "Zimri," and it is written "Achan." Rav and Shmuel: One said, his name is Achan, and why is he called Zimri? Because he did the deed of Zimri. And one said, his name is Zimri, and why is he called Achan? Because he caused the sins of Israel.

hebrew_text: אִם אֵינוֹ יוֹדֵעַ לְהִתְוַודּוֹת כּוּ׳. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר כּוּ׳. לְנַקּוֹת עַצְמָן, וִינַקּוּ עַצְמָן! כְּדֵי שֶׁלֹּא לְהוֹצִיא לַעַז עַל בָּתֵּי דִינִין וְעַל הָעֵדִים.
human_translation: if does not know how to confess, Rabbi Yehuda says to clear himself Let them clear themselves. so as not to cast aspersions on the courts and on the witnesses
llm_translation: If he does not know to confess, etc. Rabbi Yehuda says, etc. To purify themselves, and let them purify themselves! So as not to bring disgrace upon the courts and the witnesses.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּאָדָם אֶחָד שֶׁיָּצָא לֵיהָרֵג. אָמַר: אִם יֵשׁ בִּי עָוֹן זֶה, לֹא תְּהֵא מִיתָתִי כַּפָּרָה לְכׇל עֲוֹנוֹתַי. וְאִם אֵין בִּי עָוֹן זֶה, תְּהֵא מִיתָתִי כַּפָּרָה לְכׇל עֲוֹנוֹתַי, וּבֵית דִּין וְכׇל יִשְׂרָאֵל מְנוּקִּין, וְהָעֵדִים לֹא תְּהֵא לָהֶם מְחִילָה לְעוֹלָם. וּכְשֶׁשָּׁמְעוּ חֲכָמִים בַּדָּבָר, אָמְרוּ: לְהַחְזִירוֹ אִי אֶפְשָׁר, שֶׁכְּבָר נִגְזְרָה גְּזֵירָה. אֶלָּא יֵהָרֵג, וִיהֵא קוֹלָר תָּלוּי בְּצַוַּאר עֵדִים.
human_translation: The Sages taught: An incident involving a person who was being taken out to be executed He said: If I committed this sin let my death not be an atonement for all my sins; but if I did not commit this sin let my death be an atonement for all my sins. And the court and all Israel are clear but the witnesses will never be forgiven. And when the Sages heard this, they said: impossible to bring him back as the decree has already been decreed. Rather, he shall be executed, and the chain hangs around the necks of the witnesses.
llm_translation: The rabbis taught: There was an incident involving a certain man who went out to be executed. He said: If I have this sin in me, let my death serve as atonement for all my sins. And if I do not have this sin in me, let my death serve as atonement for all my sins, and the court and all of Israel are acquitted, and the witnesses shall never be granted forgiveness. And when the sages heard this matter, they said: It is impossible to return him, for the decree has already been issued. Instead, let him be executed, and a hangman's noose shall be placed around the neck of the witnesses.

hebrew_text: פְּשִׁיטָא, כֹּל כְּמִינֵּיהּ? לָא צְרִיכָא דְּקָא הָדְרִי בְּהוּ סָהֲדִי.
human_translation: obvious Is it in his power No, necessary when the witnesses retracted
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates to: "Obviously, everything according to its kind? Not necessary, as it is repeated with them as witnesses."

hebrew_text: וְכִי הָדְרִי בְּהוּ, מַאי הָוֵי? כֵּיוָן שֶׁהִגִּיד, שׁוּב אֵינוֹ חוֹזֵר וּמַגִּיד! לָא צְרִיכָא, דְּאַף עַל גַּב דְּקָא יָהֲבִי טַעְמָא לְמִילְּתַיְיהוּ, כִּי הָהוּא מַעֲשֶׂה דְּבַעְיָא מֹכְסָא.
human_translation: if retracted what of it? once stated he may not then state a revision No, necessary even when gave an explanation for their statement. like that incident involving Ba’aya the tax collector,
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates to: "And if he retracted, what is the ruling? Once he has disclosed, he cannot retract and disclose again! It is unnecessary, for even though he gave a reason for his words, it is like the incident of Ba'i Mokhsa."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הָיָה רָחוֹק מִבֵּית הַסְּקִילָה אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת, מַפְשִׁיטִין אוֹתוֹ אֶת בְּגָדָיו. הָאִישׁ מְכַסִּין אוֹתוֹ מִלְּפָנָיו, וְהָאִשָּׁה מִלְּפָנֶיהָ וּמֵאַחֲרֶיהָ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: הָאִישׁ נִסְקָל עָרוֹם, וְאֵין הָאִשָּׁה נִסְקֶלֶת עֲרוּמָּה.
human_translation: When is at a distance of four cubits from the place of stoning, they take off his clothes. They cover a man’s in the front, and a woman in the front and in the back; the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. But the Rabbis say: A man is stoned naked, but a woman is not stoned naked,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If one was distant from the place of stoning by four cubits, they remove his garments. The man is covered from before him, while the woman is covered from before and behind her - the words of Rabbi Yehuda. But the Sages say: The man is stoned naked, while the woman is not stoned naked.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הָאִישׁ מְכַסִּין אוֹתוֹ פֶּרֶק אֶחָד מִלְּפָנָיו, וְאִשָּׁה שְׁנֵי פְּרָקִים – בֵּין מִלְּפָנֶיהָ בֵּין מִלְּאַחֲרֶיהָ, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁכּוּלָּהּ עֶרְוָה. דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: הָאִישׁ נִסְקָל עָרוֹם, וְאֵין הָאִשָּׁה נִסְקֶלֶת עֲרוּמָּה.
human_translation: the Sages taught They cover a man’s one piece in the front, and a woman two pieces both in the front and in the back, because all of is nakedness, the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. But the Rabbis say: A man is stoned naked, but a woman is not stoned naked.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: A man covers himself with one garment in front of him, and a woman with two garments - whether in front of her or behind her, because her baldness is considered nakedness. These are the words of Rabbi Yehuda. And the Sages say: A man is stoned naked, but a woman is not stoned naked.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמַיְיהוּ דְּרַבָּנַן? אָמַר קְרָא: ״וְרָגְמוּ אֹתוֹ״. מַאי ״אוֹתוֹ״?
human_translation: What is the reasoning of the Rabbis, The verse states: “And shall stone him” What “him”?
llm_translation: What is the reason of the Rabbis? The verse says, "And they shall stone him." What is "him"?

hebrew_text: אִילֵּימָא אוֹתוֹ וְלֹא אוֹתָהּ, וְהָכְתִיב: ״וְהוֹצֵאתָ אֶת הָאִישׁ הַהוּא אוֹ אֶת הָאִשָּׁה הָהִיא״? אֶלָּא מַאי ״אוֹתוֹ״? אוֹתוֹ בְּלֹא כְּסוּתוֹ, הָא אוֹתָהּ בִּכְסוּתָהּ. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אוֹתוֹ בְּלֹא כְּסוּתוֹ, לָא שְׁנָא אִישׁ וְלָא שְׁנָא אִשָּׁה.
human_translation: If we say him, but not her, As isn’t it written “And you shall bring forth that man or that woman Rather, what “him”? him, without his clothes, but her with her clothing. Rabbi Yehuda says: “him” without his clothes, there is no difference a man and no difference a woman,
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "Eileima oto v'lo otah, v'haktiv: 'V'hotzeta et ha'ish hahu o et ha'isha hahi'? Ella mai 'oto'? Oto b'lo k'suto, ha ota b'k'sutah. Rabbi Yehuda omer: Oto b'lo k'suto, la sh'na ish v'la sh'na isha." English translation: If it is him and not her, and it is written: "And you shall bring out that man or that woman"? Rather, what is "him"? Him without his covering, but "her" with her covering. Rabbi Yehuda says: Him without his covering, it makes no difference whether it is a man or a woman.

hebrew_text: לְמֵימְרָא דְּרַבָּנַן חָיְישִׁי לְהִרְהוּרָא, וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה לָא חָיֵישׁ לְהִרְהוּרָא? וְהָא אִיפְּכָא שְׁמַעְנָא לְהוּ, דִּתְנַן: הַכֹּהֵן אוֹחֵז בִּבְגָדֶיהָ – אִם נִקְרְעוּ נִקְרְעוּ, וְאִם נִפְרְמוּ נִפְרְמוּ, עַד שֶׁמְּגַלֶּה אֶת לִבָּהּ וְסוֹתֵר אֶת שְׂעָרָהּ. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אִם הָיָה לִבָּהּ נָאֶה לֹא הָיָה מְגַלֵּהוּ, וְאִם הָיָה שְׂעָרָהּ נָאֶה לֹא הָיָה סוֹתְרוֹ.
human_translation: Is this to say that the Rabbis are concerned thoughts and Rabbi Yehuda is not concerned thoughts? But didn’t we hear them opposite, as we learned the priest grabs hold of her clothing If are torn, they are torn; if the stitches come apart, they come apart. until he reveals her heart, And he unbraids her hair. Rabbi Yehuda says: If her heart was attractive he would not reveal it, and if her hair was attractive he would not unbraid it.
llm_translation: In the matter of the sages, they are concerned with thought, and Rabbi Yehuda is not concerned with thought? But the opposite we heard for them, as we learned: "The priest holds onto her garments - if they tore, they tore, and if they unraveled, they unraveled, until he reveals her heart and undoes her hair." Rabbi Yehuda says: If her heart was beautiful, he would not reveal it, and if her hair was beautiful, he would not undo it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה: הָתָם הַיְינוּ טַעְמָא, שֶׁמָּא תֵּצֵא מִבֵּית דִּין זַכָּאָה וְיִתְגָּרוּ בָּהּ פִּירְחֵי כְּהוּנָּה. הָכָא הָא מִקַּטְלָא. וְכִי תֵּימָא: אָתֵי לְאִיתְגָּרוֹיֵי בְּאַחְרָנְיָיתָא? אָמַר רַבָּה: גְּמִירִי, אֵין יֵצֶר הָרָע שׁוֹלֵט אֶלָּא בְּמִי שֶׁעֵינָיו רוֹאוֹת.
human_translation: Rabba said: There, this is the reason Perhaps will leave the court innocent, and the young priests will become provoked by her. Here, she is killed And if you would say will be provoked with regard to other Rabba says: is learned that the evil inclination controls only that which eyes see.
llm_translation: Rabba said: There, the reason is because perhaps she will leave the court innocent, and the young priests will become infatuated with her beauty. Here, however, it is a matter of danger. And if you might say: Will they come to become infatuated at a later time? Rabba said: We have learned that the evil inclination only rules over one whose eyes see.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אַדְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה קַשְׁיָא, דְּרַבָּנַן אַדְּרַבָּנַן לָא קַשְׁיָא? אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אַדְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה לָא קַשְׁיָא, כִּדְשַׁנִּין.
human_translation: Rava says: of Rabbi Yehuda of Rabbi Yehuda difficult, of the Rabbis of the Rabbis not difficult? Rather, Rava says: of Rabbi Yehuda of Rabbi Yehuda not difficult, as we answered
llm_translation: Rava said: Regarding Rabbi Yehuda, it is difficult; regarding the Sages, it is not difficult? Rather, Rava said: Regarding Rabbi Yehuda, it is not difficult, as we explained.

hebrew_text: דְּרַבָּנַן אַדְּרַבָּנַן נָמֵי לָא קַשְׁיָא. אָמַר קְרָא: ״וְנִוַּסְּרוּ כׇּל הַנָּשִׁים וְלֹא תַעֲשֶׂינָה כְּזִמַּתְכֶנָה״. הָכָא, אֵין לְךָ יִיסּוּר גָּדוֹל מִזֶּה.
human_translation: of the Rabbis and of the Rabbis not difficult either. verse states that all women may be chastened not to do like your lewdness” Here, you have no chastening greater than this
llm_translation: The sages, the sages, indeed not difficult. Scripture says: "And all the women will flee, and not act like Zimri's daughter." Here, you have no greater suffering than this.

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא: לֶיעְבֵּיד בַּהּ תַּרְתֵּי? אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ: אָמַר קְרָא ״וְאָהַבְתָּ לְרֵעֲךָ כָּמוֹךָ״ – בְּרוֹר לוֹ מִיתָה יָפָה.
human_translation: And if you would say two should be done to her, Rav Naḥman says Rabba bar Avuh says: verse states: “You shall love your neighbor as yourself” select a good, death for him.
llm_translation: And if you will say: to involve oneself with it twice? Rav Nachman said in the name of Rabba bar Avuh: The verse says, "You shall love your neighbor as yourself" - choose for him a good death.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא: דְּרַב נַחְמָן תַּנָּאֵי הִיא? לָא, דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא אִית לְהוּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן, וְהָכָא בְּהָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי: מָר סָבַר בִּזְיוֹנֵי דְאִינִישׁ עֲדִיף לֵיהּ טְפֵי מִנְּיָחָא דְגוּפֵיהּ, וּמָר סָבַר נְיָחָא דְגוּפֵיהּ עֲדִיף מִבִּזְיוֹנֵיהּ.
human_translation: Let us say of Rav Naḥman is tanna’im , No, that everyone agrees with of Rav Naḥman, and here they disagree about this: Sage, holds: one’s degradation is better for him than his physical comfort, And Sage, holds that one’s physical comfort is better than his degradation,
llm_translation: Let us say: Is it a teaching of Rav Nachman? No, for everyone in the world has a teaching of Rav Nachman, and here in this case they dispute: One master holds that the disgrace of a person is more severe to him than his physical pain, and the other master holds that his physical pain is more severe than his disgrace.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ בֵּית הַסְּקִילָה הָיָה גָּבוֹהַּ שְׁתֵּי קוֹמוֹת. אֶחָד מִן הָעֵדִים דּוֹחֲפוֹ עַל מׇתְנָיו. נֶהְפַּךְ עַל לִבּוֹ, הוֹפְכוֹ עַל מׇתְנָיו. וְאִם מֵת בָּהּ – יָצָא.
human_translation: The place of stoning is twice the height one of the witnesses pushes him by the hips, he turned over onto his chest, turns him onto his hips. And if he dies through this fulfilled.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: The height of the Stoning Platform was two stories. One of the witnesses pushes him on his loins. If his heart turns over, he turns him on his loins. And if he dies from it - he has fulfilled his obligation.

hebrew_text: וְאִם לָאו, הַשֵּׁנִי נוֹטֵל אֶת הָאֶבֶן וְנוֹתְנוֹ עַל לִבּוֹ. אִם מֵת בָּהּ – יָצָא, וְאִם לָאו – רְגִימָתוֹ בְּכׇל יִשְׂרָאֵל, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״יַד הָעֵדִים תִּהְיֶה בּוֹ בָרִאשׁוֹנָה לַהֲמִיתוֹ וְיַד כׇּל הָעָם בָּאַחֲרוֹנָה״.
human_translation: And if not the second takes the stone and places, it on his chest. if he dies with this is fulfilled. And if not his stoning by all of the Jewish people, as it is stated: “The hand of the witnesses shall be first upon him to put him to death, and afterward the hand of all the people”
llm_translation: If not, the second takes the stone and puts it on his heart. If he dies from it - he is exempt, but if not - he is stoned by all of Israel, as it is said: "The hand of the witnesses shall be first upon him to put him to death, and afterward the hand of all the people."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנָא: וְקוֹמָה שֶׁלּוֹ, הֲרֵי כָּאן שָׁלֹשׁ. וּמִי בָּעֵינַן כּוּלֵּי הַאי? וּרְמִינְהוּ: מָה בּוֹר שֶׁהוּא כְּדֵי לְהָמִית – עֲשָׂרָה טְפָחִים, אַף כֹּל כְּדֵי לְהָמִית – עֲשָׂרָה טְפָחִים.
human_translation: taught and height, there is here three Do we need all that raises a contradiction just as a pit that is sufficient to cause death ten handbreadths so too, any that are sufficient to cause death ten handbreadths.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: A certain Tanna taught: And its height, here are three. Do we require the entirety of this? And it was asked: What is a pit that is deep enough to cause death? - Ten handbreadths. So too, anything deep enough to cause death - ten handbreadths.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ: אָמַר קְרָא ״וְאָהַבְתָּ לְרֵעֲךָ כָּמוֹךָ״, בְּרוֹר לוֹ מִיתָה יָפָה. אִי הָכִי, לַיגְבְּהֵיהּ טְפֵי! מִשּׁוּם דְּמִינַּוַּל.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman says Rabba bar Avuh says: verse states: “You shall love your neighbor as yourself” select a good, death for him. If so, they should raise higher. because he would become disfigured,
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said, Rabba bar Avuh said: The verse states, "You shall love your neighbor as yourself," implying a clear death is preferable for him. If not, let him be afflicted! Because he compared himself.

hebrew_text: אֶחָד מִן הָעֵדִים דּוֹחֲפוֹ. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מִנַּיִין שֶׁבִּדְחִיָּיה? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״יָרֹה״. וּמִנַּיִן שֶׁבִּסְקִילָה? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״סָקוֹל״.
human_translation: one of the witnesses pushes him the Sages taught From where by pushing The verse states shall be thrown down” And from where with stoning? The verse states: “He shall be stoned.”
llm_translation: One of the witnesses pushes him. The Rabbis taught: From where do we derive that he should be pushed? The verse teaches "he shall cast." And from where do we derive that he should be stoned? The verse teaches "he shall be stoned."

hebrew_text: וּמִנַּיִן שֶׁבִּסְקִילָה וּבִדְחִיָּיה? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״סָקוֹל יִסָּקֵל אוֹ יָרֹה יִיָּרֶה״. וּמִנַּיִן שֶׁאִם מֵת בִּדְחִיָּיה יָצָא? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אוֹ יָרֹה יִיָּרֶה״. מִנַּיִין שֶׁאַף לְדוֹרוֹת כֵּן?
human_translation: And from where by stoning and by pushing, The verse states: “He shall be stoned or shall be thrown down.” And from where that if died from the pushing, has been fulfilled, The verse states: “Or shall be thrown down,” And from where that this even to generations?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And from where do we derive that in stoning and in burning? The Torah teaches: "He shall be stoned with stones or shot through." And from where do we derive that if he dies from being shot through, he is exempt? The Torah teaches: "Or shot through." And from where do we derive that this applies to future generations as well?

hebrew_text: תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״סָקוֹל יִסָּקֵל״.
human_translation: The verse states: “He shall be stoned [ sakol yissakel ],”
llm_translation: The Talmud teaches: "Sakol yisakel."

hebrew_text: וְאִם לָאו, עֵד הַשֵּׁנִי נוֹטֵל אֶת הָאֶבֶן. נוֹטֵל? וְהָתַנְיָא: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר, אֶבֶן הָיְתָה שָׁם מַשּׂוֹי שְׁנֵי בְּנֵי אָדָם, נוֹטְלָהּ וְנוֹתְנָהּ עַל לִבּוֹ. אִם מֵת בָּהּ – יָצָא. וְלִיטַעְמָיךְ, תִּיקְשֵׁי לָךְ הִיא גּוּפַהּ: מַשּׂוֹי שְׁנֵי בְּנֵי אָדָם, נוֹטְלָהּ וְנוֹתְנָהּ עַל לִבּוֹ?
human_translation: if not the second witness takes the stone take But isn’t it taught Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: A stone was there a weight two men. takes it and places, it on chest. If he dies with this is fulfilled. And according to your reasoning, itself should pose a difficulty for you, a weight two men, takes it and places it on chest,
llm_translation: And if not, the second witness takes the stone. Takes? But it was taught: Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says, "There was a stone there placed by two people, he takes it and places it on his heart. If he dies with it - he is exempt." And to your taste, it is difficult for you: its body is its essence - placed by two people, he takes it and places it on his heart?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, דְּמַדְלֵי לַהּ בַּהֲדֵי חַבְרֵיהּ, וְשָׁדֵי לַהּ אִיהוּ, כִּי הֵיכִי דְּתֵיתֵי מֵרַזְיָא.
human_translation: Rather, lifts together with the other but casts it so that it should fall with force
llm_translation: Rather, he would argue with his colleagues, and persuade him, so that he may accept the opinion.

hebrew_text: וְאִם לָאו, רְגִימָתוֹ כּוּ׳. וְהָתַנְיָא: מֵעוֹלָם לֹא שָׁנָה בָּהּ אָדָם! מִי קָאָמֵינָא דְּעָבֵיד? דְּאִי מִצְּרִיךְ קָאָמֵינָא.
human_translation: And if not his stoning But isn’t it taught Never did a person repeat Did we say that they acted we said that if it was necessary
llm_translation: "And if not, his stoning is thus. And it was taught: A person never changes in it! Who are we saying does? For if it is necessary, we are saying."

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: אֶבֶן הָיְתָה כּוּ׳. וְהָתַנְיָא: אַחַת אֶבֶן שֶׁנִּסְקָל בָּהּ, וְאַחַת עֵץ שֶׁנִּתְלֶה עָלָיו, וְאֶחָד סַיִיף שֶׁנֶּהֱרָג בּוֹ, וְאֶחָד סוּדָר שֶׁנֶּחְנָק בּוֹ – כּוּלָּן נִקְבָּרִין עִמּוֹ. לָא צְרִיכָא דִּמְתַקְּנִי וּמַיְיתִי אַחֲרִינֵי חִלּוּפַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: The Master said a stone was But isn’t it taught The stone with which was stoned and the tree on which was hung, or the sword with which he was killed, or the cloth with which he was strangled, all are buried with him? No, necessary that they would prepare other and bring them in their place.
llm_translation: Master said: "It was a stone." And it was taught: One stone that was stoned with, and one wood that was hanged on it, and one sword that was killed with, and one beam that was choked with - all of them are buried with him. It is not necessary to fix and bring others after their replacements.

hebrew_text: נִקְבָּרִין עִמּוֹ. וְהָתַנְיָא: אֵין נִקְבָּרִין עִמּוֹ? אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: מַאי ״עִמּוֹ״? עִמּוֹ בִּתְפִיסָתוֹ.
human_translation: are buried with But isn’t it taught they are not buried with Rav Pappa said: What with him? within his grasp,
llm_translation: Buried with him. And it was taught: Are they not buried with him? Rav Papa said: What is "with him"? With him in his possession.

hebrew_text: אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: נִקְטְעָה יַד הָעֵדִים – פָּטוּר. מַאי טַעְמָא? דְּבָעֵינָא ״יַד הָעֵדִים תִּהְיֶה בּוֹ בָרִאשׁוֹנָה,״ וְלֵיכָּא.
human_translation: Shmuel says: the witnesses’ hands were severed exempt What is the reason because I need “The hand of the witnesses shall be first upon him to put him to death” and not
llm_translation: Samuel said: If the hand of the witnesses was cut off - he is exempt. What is the reason? Because I require "the hand of the witnesses shall be against him first," and it is not there.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, עֵדִים גִּידְמִין דְּמֵעִיקָּרָא, הָכִי נָמֵי דִּפְסִילִי? שָׁאנֵי הָתָם, דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״יַד הָעֵדִים״, שֶׁהָיְתָה כְּבָר.
human_translation: If that is so, the witnesses lacked hands from the outset, are they also disqualified? There it is different, as the verse states: “The hand of the witnesses,” that were already
llm_translation: Rather from now, witnesses first, so say that invalid? Different there, as said Scripture: "hand of the witnesses," that was already.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁיְּעִידוּהוּ שְׁנַיִם וְיֹאמְרוּ, ״מְעִידִין אָנוּ בְּאִישׁ פְּלוֹנִי שֶׁנִּגְמַר דִּינוֹ בְּבֵית דִּין פְּלוֹנִי, וּפְלוֹנִי וּפְלוֹנִי עֵדָיו״ – הֲרֵי זֶה יֵהָרֵג. תַּרְגְּמָא שְׁמוּאֵל בְּ״הֵּן הֵן עֵדָיו״.
human_translation: raises an objection any place where two testify and say: We testify about so-and-so that his sentence was issued in such and such a court, and so-and-so and so-and-so his witnesses, he is executed, Shmuel interpreted in are the same witnesses
llm_translation: Challenger: Any place where two testify and say, "We testify concerning a certain individual that his judgment was completed in the court of such and such, and such and such and such and such are his witnesses" - this one shall be executed. Samuel translated it as "they are his witnesses."

hebrew_text: וּמִי בָּעֵינַן קְרָא כְּדִכְתִיב? וְהָתַנְיָא: ״מוֹת יוּמַת הַמַּכֶּה רוֹצֵחַ הוּא״ – אֵין לִי אֶלָּא בְּמִיתָה הַכְּתוּבָה בּוֹ. מִנַּיִן שֶׁאִם אִי אַתָּה יָכוֹל לַהֲמִיתוֹ בְּמִיתָה הַכְּתוּבָה בּוֹ שֶׁאַתָּה מְמִיתוֹ בְּכׇל מִיתָה שֶׁאַתָּה יָכוֹל לַהֲמִיתוֹ? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״מוֹת יוּמַת הַמַּכֶּה״ – מִכׇּל מָקוֹם.
human_translation: But do we need the verse as it is written? But isn’t it taught “He that smote him shall be put to death, for he is a murderer” I have only with the execution written concerning him, From where that if you cannot put him to death with the execution written concerning him, you can put him to death with any execution with which you can put him to death? The verse states: “He that smote him shall be put to death [ mot yumat ],” in any case,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And who do we require a verse as it is written? And it was taught: "He shall surely be put to death, the murderer is he" - I only have it with the death written about him. From where do we derive that if you are able to kill him with the death written about him, you kill him with any death that you are able to kill him with? The Talmud teaches: "He shall surely be put to death, the murderer" - from any place.

hebrew_text: שָׁאנֵי הָתָם, דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״מוֹת יוּמַת״.
human_translation: There, it is different, as the verse states: “He shall be put to death,”
llm_translation: The difference there is, as the verse states: "He shall surely be put to death."

hebrew_text: וְלִיגְמַר מִינֵּיהּ? מִשּׁוּם דְּהָוֵה רוֹצֵחַ וְגוֹאֵל הַדָּם שְׁנֵי כְּתוּבִין הַבָּאִין כְּאֶחָד, וְכׇל שְׁנֵי כְּתוּבִין הַבָּאִין כְּאֶחָד אֵין מְלַמְּדִין.
human_translation: But learn from because the murderer and the blood redeemer, are two verses that come as one, and two verses that come as one do not teach
llm_translation: And to learn from it? Because he becomes a murderer and the blood redeemer, two Scriptures that come as one, and all two Scriptures that come as one do not teach.

hebrew_text: רוֹצֵחַ – הָא דַּאֲמַרַן. גּוֹאֵל הַדָּם מַאי הִיא? דְּתַנְיָא: ״גֹּאֵל הַדָּם יָמִית אֶת הָרֹצֵחַ״ – מִצְוָה בְּגוֹאֵל הַדָּם. וּמִנַּיִין שֶׁאִם אֵין לוֹ גּוֹאֵל שֶׁבֵּית דִּין מַעֲמִידִין לוֹ גּוֹאֵל? שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״בְּפִגְעוֹ בּוֹ״ – מִכׇּל מָקוֹם.
human_translation: a murderer this that we said a blood redeemer, what is it? As it is taught “The blood redeemer shall slay the murderer mitzva on the blood redeemer, And from where that if has no redeemer the court appoints redeemer for him? As it is stated: “When he meets him,” in any case
llm_translation: MURDERER - THIS THAT WE SAY. REDEEMER OF THE BLOOD WHAT IS IT? FOR IT WAS TAUGHT: "THE REDEEMER OF BLOOD SHALL PUT TO DEATH THE MURDERER" - A COMMANDMENT IN THE REDEEMER OF BLOOD. AND FROM WHERE DO WE DERIVE THAT IF HE HAS NO REDEEMER, THE COURT ESTABLISHES A REDEEMER FOR HIM? FOR IT IS STATED: "WHEN HE STRIKES HIM" - FROM ANY PLACE.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ מָר קַשִּׁישָׁא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב חִסְדָּא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: וּמִי לָא בָּעֵינַן קְרָא כְּדִכְתִיב? וְהָתְנַן: הָיָה אֶחָד מֵהֶן גִּידֵּם, אוֹ אִילֵּם, אוֹ חִיגֵּר, אוֹ סוֹמֵא, אוֹ חֵרֵשׁ – אֵינוֹ נַעֲשָׂה בֵּן סוֹרֵר וּמוֹרֶה.
human_translation: Mar Kashisha, son of Rav Ḥisda, said to Rav Ashi: And do we not need the verse as it is written? But didn’t we learn one of is without a hand, or mute, or lame, or blind, or deaf, is not rendered a stubborn and rebellious son?
llm_translation: He said to him, Master Kashisha, son of Rav Chisda, to Rav Ashe: "Do we not require a verse as it is written? And we learned: If one of them had a sinew, or testicles, or a membrane, or a foreskin, or was deaf - he does not become a rebellious son and a teacher."

hebrew_text: שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְתָפְשׂוּ בוֹ״ – וְלֹא גִּידְמִין, ״וְהוֹצִיאוּ אֹתוֹ״ – וְלֹא חִיגְּרִין, ״וְאָמְרוּ״ – וְלֹא אִילְּמִין, ״בְּנֵנוּ זֶה״ – וְלֹא סוֹמִין, ״אֵינֶנּוּ שֹׁמֵעַ בְּקֹלֵנוּ״ – וְלֹא חֵרְשִׁין.
human_translation: as it is stated: “lay hold of him,” but not without a hand “and bring him out,” but not lame “And they shall say,” but not mute people; “this our son,” but not the blind, “he does not obey our voice,” but not the deaf.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: As it is stated: "And they shall seize him" - not Gidmin, "and they shall bring him out" - not Higgrin, "and they shall say" - not Ilmin, "with this son of ours" - not Sommin, "he does not listen to our voice" - not Hershin.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא? לָאו מִשּׁוּם דְּבָעֵינַן קְרָא כְּדִכְתִיב? לָא, שָׁאנֵי הָתָם, דְּכוּלֵּיהּ קְרָא יַתִּירָא הוּא.
human_translation: What is the reason Is it not because we need the verse as it is written, No, there, it is different, as the entire verse is superfluous.
llm_translation: What is the reason? Not because we require a verse as it is written? No, it is different there, as the entire verse is extra.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: אֵין לָהּ רְחוֹב – אֵין נַעֲשֵׂית עִיר הַנִּדַּחַת, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: אֵין לָהּ רְחוֹב – עוֹשִׂין לָהּ רְחוֹב.
human_translation: Come hear does not have an open place, it is not rendered an idolatrous city; the statement of Rabbi Yishmael. Rabbi Akiva says: it does not have an open place, they make an open place for it.
llm_translation: Come and hear: If it does not have a public square - it is not made into a city of refuge, the words of Rabbi Yishmael. Rabbi Akiva says: If it does not have a public square - they make one for it.

hebrew_text: עַד כָּאן לָא פְּלִיגִי, אֶלָּא דְּמָר סָבַר: ״רְחוֹבָהּ״ דְּמֵעִיקָּרָא בָּעִינַן, וּמָר סָבַר: רְחוֹבָהּ דְּהַשְׁתָּא נָמֵי כִּדְמֵעִיקָּרָא דָּמֵי. אֲבָל דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא בָּעֵינַן קְרָא כְּדִכְתִיב.
human_translation: disagree only with regard to that Sage, holds we need an open place from the outset while the Sage, holds an open place now is like from the outset. But everyone we need the verse as it is written.
llm_translation: Until here they do not argue, rather Mar holds: "its width" we require from the outset, and Mar holds: its width now is also considered like from the outset. But for all people we require a verse, as it is written.

hebrew_text: תַּנָּאֵי הִיא, דִּתְנַן: אֵין לוֹ בֹּהֶן יָד, בֹּהֶן רֶגֶל, אֹזֶן יָמָנִית – אֵין לוֹ טׇהֳרָה עוֹלָמִית. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: נוֹתֵן עַל מְקוֹמוֹ וְיוֹצֵא. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: נוֹתֵן עַל שְׂמֹאלוֹ וְיוֹצֵא.
human_translation: is tanna’im . As we learned has no thumb, big toe, right ear, he can never ritual purity, Rabbi Eliezer says: apply to the place and has fulfilled Rabbi Shimon says: apply to his left and has fulfilled
llm_translation: It is taught in a Baraita: as we learned: if one does not have a hand, a foot, a right ear - he does not have eternal purity. Rabbi Eliezer says: he places it in its place and goes out. Rabbi Shimon says: he places it on his left and goes out.
