hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ כׇּל הַנִּסְקָלִין נִתְלִין, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֵינוֹ נִתְלֶה אֶלָּא הַמְגַדֵּף וְהָעוֹבֵד עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה.
human_translation: who are stoned are hung the statement of Rabbi Eliezer. And the Rabbis say: Only the blasphemer, and the idol worshipper are hung.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: All those who are stoned are hanged, the words of Rabbi Eliezer. And the Sages say: Only the blasphemer and the idolater are hanged.

hebrew_text: הָאִישׁ תּוֹלִין אוֹתוֹ פָּנָיו כְּלַפֵּי הָעָם, וְהָאִשָּׁה פָּנֶיהָ כְּלַפֵּי הָעֵץ; דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: הָאִישׁ נִתְלֶה וְאֵין הָאִשָּׁה נִתְלֵית. אָמַר לָהֶן רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: וַהֲלֹא שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן שָׁטַח תָּלָה נָשִׁים בְּאַשְׁקְלוֹן? אָמְרוּ לוֹ: שְׁמוֹנִים נָשִׁים תָּלָה, וְאֵין דָּנִין שְׁנַיִם בְּיוֹם אֶחָד.
human_translation: a man is hung facing the people, but a woman, facing the tree; the statement of Rabbi Eliezer. And the Rabbis say: a man is hung, but a woman is not hung. Rabbi Eliezer said to Did Shimon ben Shataḥ not hang in Ashkelon women They said to him: he hanged eighty women and may not judge two on the same day.
llm_translation: The man hangs him his face towards the people, and the woman her face towards the tree; the words of Rabbi Eliezer. And the sages say: The man is hanged, but the woman is not hanged. Rabbi Eliezer said to them: Did not Simeon ben Shatah hang women in Ashkelon? They said to him: He hanged eighty women, and they do not judge two on the same day.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״וְהוּמָת וְתָלִיתָ״ – יָכוֹל כׇּל הַמּוּמָתִין נִתְלִין? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״כִּי קִלְלַת אֱלֹהִים תָּלוּי״. מָה מְקַלֵּל זֶה שֶׁבִּסְקִילָה, אַף כֹּל שֶׁבִּסְקִילָה. דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר.
human_translation: The Sages taught and he is put to death, and you shall hang might all those who are put to death are hung. the verse states: for he that is hung is a curse of God” just as the blasphemer, is to stoning, so too, all those to stoning the statement of Rabbi Eliezer.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: "And he who curses shall surely be put to death" - Could all those who are liable to be put to death by stoning be hanged? The Torah teaches: "For the curse of God is he hanged." Just as this one who is cursed with stoning, so too, all those who are cursed with stoning. These are the words of Rabbi Eliezer.

hebrew_text: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: מָה מְקַלֵּל זֶה שֶׁכָּפַר בָּעִיקָּר, אַף כֹּל שֶׁכָּפַר בָּעִיקָּר.
human_translation: And the Rabbis say: Just as the blasphemer, denies the principle so too, all who deny the principle
llm_translation: The Sages say: Just as this one who curses has atoned fundamentally, so too, anyone who has atoned fundamentally.

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי קָא מִיפַּלְגִי? רַבָּנַן דָּרְשִׁי כְּלָלֵי וּפְרָטֵי, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר דָּרֵישׁ רִיבּוּיֵי וּמִיעוּטֵי.
human_translation: With regard to what do they disagree? The Rabbis interpret generalizations and details, Rabbi Eliezer interprets amplifications and restrictions,
llm_translation: With what do they disagree? The Rabbis interpret generalizations and specifics, Rabbi Eliezer interprets inclusively and exclusively.

hebrew_text: רַבָּנַן דָּרְשִׁי כְּלָלֵי וּפְרָטֵי: ״וְהוּמָת וְתָלִיתָ״ – כְּלָל, ״כִּי קִלְלַת״ – פְּרָט. אִי הֲווֹ מְקָרְבִי לַהֲדָדֵי, אָמְרִינַן: אֵין בַּכְּלָל אֶלָּא מַה שֶּׁבַּפְּרָט. הָנֵי – אִין, מִידֵּי אַחֲרִינָא – לָא.
human_translation: The Rabbis expound generalizations and details. “And he is put to death, and you shall hang a generalization, “For a curse of a detail, Were next to each other we would say the generalization includes only that which is in the detail. this yes, anyone else not.
llm_translation: The sages expounded general and specific: "and you shall die and surely die" - general, "for you have cursed" - specific. If they were close to each other, we say: the general includes only what is in the specific. Those - no, from other things - no.

hebrew_text: הַשְׁתָּא דִּמְרַחֲקִי מֵהֲדָדֵי, אַהֲנִי לְרַבּוֹיֵי עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה, דְּדָמֵי לֵיהּ בְּכֹל מִילֵּי.
human_translation: Now that are distant from each other, serve to include idol worship, as he is similar to in all matters.
llm_translation: At that time when they were distant from Hadadei, they were discussing with their masters about foreign worship, for it is similar to him in all matters.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר דָּרֵישׁ רִיבּוּיֵי וּמִיעוּטֵי, ״וְהוּמָת וְתָלִיתָ״ – רִבּוּי, ״כִּי קִלְלַת״ – מִיעוּט. אִי הֲווֹ מְקָרְבִי לַהֲדָדֵי, לָא הֲווֹ מְרַבִּינַן אֶלָּא עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה דְּדָמֵי לֵהּ בְּכֹל מִילֵּי. הַשְׁתָּא דִּמְרַחֲקִי מֵהֲדָדֵי, אַהֲנִי לְרַבּוֹיֵי שְׁאָר הַנִּסְקָלִין.
human_translation: And Rabbi Eliezer, interprets amplifications and restrictions. “And he is put to death, and you shall hang an amplification. “For a curse of a restriction. Were next to each other, we would include only idol worship, as he is similar to in all ways. Now that they are distant from each other, serve to include those who are stoned
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer expounds on the terms of inclusion and exclusion, "And you shall hang him on a tree" - inclusion, "for a curse" - exclusion. If they were close to each other, we would only include idol worship that is similar to it in all respects. Now that they are distant from each other, we include all other forms of stoning.

hebrew_text: הָאִישׁ תּוֹלִין וְכוּ׳. מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבָּנַן? אָמַר קְרָא: ״וְתָלִיתָ אֹתוֹ״ – אוֹתוֹ, וְלֹא אוֹתָהּ. וְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: ״אוֹתוֹ״ – בְּלֹא כְּסוּתוֹ.
human_translation: a man is hung What is the reasoning of the Rabbis? the verse states: and you shall hang him him but not her And Rabbi Eliezer him without his clothing.
llm_translation: The man is suspended, etc. What is the reason of the Rabbis? The verse says: "And you shall hang him" - him, and not her. And Rabbi Eliezer: "him" - without his garment.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן, אִין הָכִי נָמֵי. אֶלָּא אָמַר קְרָא: ״וְכִי יִהְיֶה בְאִישׁ חֵטְא״ – אִישׁ, וְלֹא אִשָּׁה.
human_translation: And the Rabbis Yes, it is indeed so But the verse states: “And if a man has committed a sin,” a man but a woman not
llm_translation: The Sages do not say so. Rather, the verse says: "If a man commits a sin" - a man, and not a woman.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, הַאי ״וְכִי יִהְיֶה בְאִישׁ״ מַאי דָּרֵישׁ בֵּיהּ? אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: הָהוּא לְמַעוֹטֵי בֵּן סוֹרֵר וּמוֹרֶה. וְהָתַנְיָא: בֵּן סוֹרֵר וּמוֹרֶה נִסְקָל וְנִתְלֶה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר! אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: לְרַבּוֹת בֵּן סוֹרֵר וּמוֹרֶה. מַאי טַעְמָא?
human_translation: And Rabbi Eliezer, what does he learn from this “And if a man Reish Lakish says: That to exclude a stubborn and rebellious son, But isn’t it taught A stubborn and rebellious son is stoned and hung; the statement of Rabbi Eliezer? Rather, Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak says: to include a stubborn and rebellious son, What is the reason
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer, this "And if there will be in a man," what does he expound in it? Reish Lakish said: That is to exclude the wayward and rebellious son. And it was taught: The wayward and rebellious son is stoned and hanged, the words of Rabbi Eliezer! Rather, Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: To include the wayward and rebellious son. What is the reason?

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״וְכִי יִהְיֶה בְאִישׁ חֵטְא״ – אִישׁ, וְלֹא בֵּן. ״חֵטְא״ – מִי שֶׁעַל חֶטְאוֹ נֶהֱרָג, יָצָא בֵּן סוֹרֵר וּמוֹרֶה שֶׁעַל שׁוּם סוֹפוֹ נֶהֱרָג. הָוֵי מִיעוּט אַחַר מִיעוּט, וְאֵין מִיעוּט אַחַר מִיעוּט אֶלָּא לְרַבּוֹת.
human_translation: As the verse states: “And if a man has committed a sin,” a man but not a child, “sin” one who is put to death on account of a sin to the exclusion of a stubborn and rebellious son, who is executed on account of the future. This is a restrictive expression following a restrictive expression, And a restrictive expression following a restrictive expression only to amplify
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "As the verse says: 'If there is in a man a sin' - a man, and not a son. 'A sin' - one who is put to death for his sin, a rebellious and defiant son who, due to his ultimate end, is put to death. Be restrictive after a restriction, and a restriction after a restriction is only to include more."

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָהֶן רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: וַהֲלֹא שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן שָׁטַח תָּלָה נָשִׁים כּוּ׳? אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא בִּשְׁתֵּי מִיתוֹת, אֲבָל בְּמִיתָה אַחַת – דָּנִין. וְהָא מַעֲשֶׂה דְּשִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן שָׁטַח דְּמִיתָה אַחַת הֲוַאי, וְקָא אָמְרוּ לֵיהּ דְּאֵין דָּנִין!
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer said to Did Shimon ben Shataḥ not hang in Ashkelon women Rav Ḥisda says: They taught only when two execution, but when one execution, may judge But the incident Shimon ben Shataḥ involved one execution, yet said to him that may not judge
llm_translation: He said to them Rabbi Eliezer: But did not Shimon ben Shatach hang women? Rav Hisda said: They only taught this regarding two types of death, but with one type of death - they judge. And the incident of Shimon ben Shatach was with one type of death, and they told him that they do not judge!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, אִי אִיתְּמַר הָכִי אִיתְּמַר: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא בְּמִיתָה אַחַת כְּעֵין שְׁתֵּי מִיתוֹת. וְהֵיכִי דָּמֵי? כְּגוֹן שְׁתֵּי עֲבֵירוֹת. אֲבָל בְּמִיתָה אַחַת וַעֲבֵירָה אַחַת – דָּנִין.
human_translation: Rather, if was stated this is was stated: They taught only when one execution similar to two execution. And what are the circumstances For example, two transgressions But one execution and one transgression, may judge
llm_translation: Rather, if it was stated thus, it was stated thus: They only taught regarding one death similar to two deaths. And how so? For example, two transgressions. But with one death and one transgression - they are judged.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה: אֵין דָּנִין שְׁנַיִם בְּיוֹם אֶחָד, וַאֲפִילּוּ בְּנוֹאֵף וְנוֹאֶפֶת. תַּרְגְּמָא רַב חִסְדָּא: בְּבַת כֹּהֵן וּבוֹעֲלָהּ,
human_translation: Rav Adda bar Ahava raises an objection may not judge two on one day, even an adulterer and an adulteress. Rav Ḥisda interpreted the daughter of a priest and the man with whom she engaged in intercourse,
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: Rav Adda bar Ahava asks: One does not judge two cases on the same day, even if it involves a male adulterer and a female adulteress. The Targum translation of Rav Ḥisdah: This applies to the daughter of a kohen who is married and the one who has relations with her.

hebrew_text: אוֹ בְּבַת כֹּהֵן וְזוֹמְמֵי זוֹמְמֶיהָ.
human_translation: Or, the daughter of a priest and those who rendered as conspiring witnesses rendered as conspiring witnesses her.
llm_translation: Or in the daughter of a Kohen, and the plotters plot against her.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב אוֹמֵר: שָׁמַעְתִּי שֶׁבֵּית דִּין מַכִּין וְעוֹנְשִׁין שֶׁלֹּא מִן הַתּוֹרָה, וְלֹא לַעֲבוֹר עַל דִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה, אֶלָּא כְּדֵי לַעֲשׂוֹת סְיָיג לַתּוֹרָה.
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov says: I heard that the court may administer lashes and punishment, when not by Torah And not of violating the statement of the Torah, rather, to erect a fence around the Torah,
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov says: I have heard that the court administers beatings and punishments that are not from the Torah, not to transgress the words of the Torah, but in order to make a protective fence for the Torah.

hebrew_text: וּמַעֲשֶׂה בְּאֶחָד שֶׁרָכַב עַל סוּס בְּשַׁבָּת בִּימֵי יְוָנִים, וֶהֱבִיאוּהוּ לְבֵית דִּין וּסְקָלוּהוּ, לֹא מִפְּנֵי שֶׁרָאוּי לְכָךְ, אֶלָּא שֶׁהַשָּׁעָה צְרִיכָה לְכָךְ. שׁוּב מַעֲשֶׂה בְּאָדָם אֶחָד שֶׁהֵטִיחַ אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ תַּחַת הַתְּאֵנָה, וֶהֱבִיאוּהוּ לְבֵית דִּין וְהִלְקוּהוּ, לֹא מִפְּנֵי שֶׁרָאוּי לְכָךְ, אֶלָּא שֶׁהַשָּׁעָה צְרִיכָה לְכָךְ.
human_translation: And an incident involving one who rode a horse on Shabbat during the days of the Greeks, and they brought him to court and stoned him, not because he deserved that but because the hour required it, Another incident involving a man who engaged in intercourse with his wife under a fig tree, and they brought him to court and flogged him, not because that was fitting but because the hour required it.
llm_translation: And there was an incident with one who rode on a horse on Shabbat in the days of the Greeks, and they brought him to the court and stoned him, not because he deserved it, but because the time required it. Similarly, there was an incident with a certain man who had relations with his wife under a fig tree, and they brought him to the court and flogged him, not because he deserved it, but because the time required it.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ כֵּיצַד תּוֹלִין אוֹתוֹ? מְשַׁקְּעִין אֶת הַקּוֹרָה בָּאָרֶץ, וְהָעֵץ יוֹצֵא וּמַקִּיף שְׁתֵּי יָדָיו זוֹ עַל גַּב זוֹ, וְתוֹלֶה אוֹתוֹ. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: הַקּוֹרָה מוּטָּה עַל הַכּוֹתֶל, וְתוֹלֶה אוֹתוֹ כְּדֶרֶךְ שֶׁהַטַּבָּחִין עוֹשִׂין.
human_translation: How do they hang They sink a post into the earth wood jutting out, And places two hands one upon the other, and hangs him Rabbi Yosei says: The post leans against a wall, and he hangs the way that butchers do
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: How is it suspended? They embed the beam in the ground, and the wood extends and encircles both of its hands on its back, and suspends it. Rabbi Yosei says: The beam is leaning against the wall, and it is suspended as butchers do.

hebrew_text: וּמַתִּירִין אוֹתוֹ מִיָּד, וְאִם לָן – עוֹבֵר עָלָיו בְּלֹא תַעֲשֶׂה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לֹא תָלִין נִבְלָתוֹ עַל הָעֵץ כִּי קָבוֹר תִּקְבְּרֶנּוּ כִּי קִלְלַת אֱלֹהִים תָּלוּי וְגוֹ׳״. כְּלוֹמַר, מִפְּנֵי מָה זֶה תָּלוּי? מִפְּנֵי שֶׁבֵּירַךְ אֶת הַשֵּׁם, וְנִמְצָא שֵׁם שָׁמַיִם מִתְחַלֵּל.
human_translation: and they immediately untie him. And if he was left overnight, a prohibition is transgressed, as it is stated: “His body shall not remain all night upon the tree, but you shall bury him for he that is hung is a curse of God” That is to say: For what was this one hung Because he blessed God, And therefore the name of Heaven would be desecrated
llm_translation: And they permit him immediately, and if not - he transgresses a negative commandment, as it is stated: "His carcass shall not remain overnight upon the tree, but you shall bury him the same day, for a curse of God is the one who is hanged." Meaning, why is he hanged? Because he has blasphemed the Name, and the Name of Heaven is thereby profaned.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי מֵאִיר: בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁאָדָם מִצְטַעֵר, שְׁכִינָה מָה לָשׁוֹן אוֹמֶרֶת? ״קַלַּנִי מֵרֹאשִׁי, קַלַּנִי מִזְּרוֹעִי״. אִם כֵּן הַמָּקוֹם מִצְטַעֵר עַל דָּמָן שֶׁל רְשָׁעִים שֶׁנִּשְׁפָּךְ, קַל וְחוֹמֶר עַל דָּמָן שֶׁל צַדִּיקִים.
human_translation: Rabbi Meir said: When a man suffers what expression does the Divine Presence use? I am distressed [ kallani ] about My head, I am distressed about My arm, If God suffers over the blood of the wicked that is spilled, a fortiori over the blood of the righteous.
llm_translation: Rabbi Meir said: At the time when a person is distressed, what does the Shekhinah say? "Remove me from my head, remove me from my arm." If so, if the Omnipresent is distressed over the blood of the wicked that is spilled, all the more so over the blood of the righteous.

hebrew_text: וְלֹא זוֹ בִּלְבַד אָמְרוּ, אֶלָּא כָּל הַמֵּלִין אֶת מֵתוֹ עוֹבֵר בְּלֹא תַעֲשֶׂה. הֱלִינוֹ לִכְבוֹדוֹ, לְהָבִיא לוֹ אָרוֹן וְתַכְרִיכִים – אֵינוֹ עוֹבֵר עָלָיו.
human_translation: And said not only this, but anyone who leaves his deceased overnight transgresses a prohibition. he left overnight for the sake of honor, to bring a coffin or shrouds he does not transgress
llm_translation: And not this alone they said, rather anyone who curses his deceased transgresses a negative commandment. If he eulogizes him for honor, to bring him a coffin and shrouds - he does not transgress.

hebrew_text: וְלֹא הָיוּ קוֹבְרִין אוֹתוֹ בְּקִבְרוֹת אֲבוֹתָיו, אֶלָּא שְׁתֵּי בָּתֵּי קְבָרוֹת הָיוּ מְתוּקָּנִין לְבֵית דִּין: אַחַת לַנֶּהֱרָגִין וְלַנֶּחְנָקִין, וְאַחַת לַנִּסְקָלִין וְלַנִּשְׂרָפִין. נִתְעַכֵּל הַבָּשָׂר, מְלַקְּטִין אֶת הָעֲצָמוֹת וְקוֹבְרִין אוֹתָן בִּמְקוֹמָן. וְהַקְּרוֹבִים בָּאִים וְשׁוֹאֲלִים בִּשְׁלוֹם הַדַּיָּינִין וּבִשְׁלוֹם הָעֵדִים, כְּלוֹמַר שֶׁאֵין בְּלִבֵּנוּ עֲלֵיכֶם שֶׁדִּין אֱמֶת דַּנְתֶּם.
human_translation: and they would not bury him in his ancestral plot. Rather, two graveyards were established for the court: One for those who were killed or strangled, and one for those who were stoned or burned. the flesh had decomposed, they would gather his bones and bury them in their place And the relatives would come and inquire about the welfare of the judges and about the welfare of the witnesses, as if to say: We hold no against you, as you judged a true judgment.
llm_translation: And not they were burying him in the graves of his fathers, rather two houses of burial were prepared for the court: one for those who were killed and strangled, and one for those who were stoned and burned. The flesh decomposed, they collect the bones and bury them in their place. And the relatives come and inquire about the welfare of the judges and the welfare of the witnesses, as if to say that we have no doubt in our hearts about you, that you judged with true judgment.

hebrew_text: וְלֹא הָיוּ מִתְאַבְּלִין, אֲבָל אוֹנְנִין, שֶׁאֵין אֲנִינוּת אֶלָּא בַּלֵּב.
human_translation: And would not mourn but they would grieve since grief is only in the heart.
llm_translation: And they were not mourning, but they were lamenting, for Aninut is only in the heart.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אִילּוּ נֶאֱמַר ״חֵטְא וְתָלִיתָ״, הָיִיתִי אוֹמֵר תּוֹלִין אוֹתוֹ וְאַחַר כָּךְ מְמִיתִין אוֹתוֹ, כְּדֶרֶךְ שֶׁהַמַּלְכוּת עוֹשָׂה. תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְהוּמָת וְתָלִיתָ״ – מְמִיתִין אוֹתוֹ וְאַחַר כָּךְ תּוֹלִין אוֹתוֹ. הָא כֵּיצַד? מְשַׁהִין אוֹתוֹ עַד סָמוּךְ לִשְׁקִיעַת הַחַמָּה, וְגוֹמְרִין אֶת דִּינוֹ, וּמְמִיתִין אוֹתוֹ, וְאַחַר כָּךְ תּוֹלִין אוֹתוֹ. אֶחָד קוֹשֵׁר וְאֶחָד מַתִּיר, כְּדֵי לְקַיֵּים מִצְוַת תְּלִיָּיה.
human_translation: The Sages taught Were it stated: a sin you shall hang I would have said they hang him and afterward they put him to death, the way the government does, the verse states: and he is put to death, and you shall hang they put him to death, and afterward they hang him. How so? They delay until near sunset, and they conclude his judgment, and they put him to death, and afterward hang him. One ties and another unties in order to fulfill the mitzva of hanging
llm_translation: The Sages taught: If it were stated, "He shall be put to death and you shall hang him," I would say that we first hang him and then put him to death, in the manner that the kingdom does. The Torah teaches: "And he shall be put to death and you shall hang him" - we put him to death first and then hang him. How so? We delay his execution until close to sunset, complete his judgment, put him to death, and then hang him. One ties and one unties, in order to fulfill the commandment of hanging.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״עֵץ״ – שׁוֹמֵעַ אֲנִי בֵּין בְּתָלוּשׁ בֵּין בִּמְחוּבָּר. תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״כִּי קָבוֹר״ – מִי שֶׁאֵינוֹ מְחוּסָּר אֶלָּא קְבוּרָה, יָצָא זֶה שֶׁמְחוּסָּר קְצִיצָה וּקְבוּרָה.
human_translation: The Sages taught: a tree,” I derive either detached or attached the verse states: but you shall bury kavor that is lacking only burial, exclude that is lacking cutting down and burial.
llm_translation: The sages taught: "Etz" - I understand whether it is detached or attached. The Talmud teaches to say "ki kavor" - one who lacks only burial, this one has fulfilled the requirement of both excision and burial.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: מִי שֶׁאֵינוֹ מְחוּסָּר אֶלָּא קְבוּרָה – יָצָא זֶה שֶׁמְחוּסָּר תְּלִישָׁה וּקְבוּרָה. וְרַבָּנַן: תְּלִישָׁה לָאו כְּלוּם הִיא.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: lacking only burial. exclude that is lacking detachment and burial. And the Rabbis Detaching is nothing,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: One who lacks only burial - this one has fulfilled both lack of shrouds and burial. And the Rabbis say: Lack of shrouds is nothing.

hebrew_text: כְּלוֹמַר: מִפְּנֵי מָה זֶה תָּלוּי? מִפְּנֵי שֶׁבֵּירַךְ כּוּ׳. תַּנְיָא, אוֹמֵר רַבִּי מֵאִיר: מָשְׁלוּ מָשָׁל, לְמָה הַדָּבָר דּוֹמֶה? לִשְׁנֵי אַחִים תְּאוֹמִים בְּעִיר אַחַת. אֶחָד מִינּוּהוּ מֶלֶךְ, וְאֶחָד יָצָא לְלִיסְטִיּוּת. צִוָּה הַמֶּלֶךְ וּתְלָאוּהוּ. כׇּל הָרוֹאֶה אוֹתוֹ אוֹמֵר: הַמֶּלֶךְ תָּלוּי. צִוָּה הַמֶּלֶךְ וְהוֹרִידוּהוּ.
human_translation: That is to say: For what was this one hung? Because he blessed It is taught Rabbi Meir says: told a parable: To what is this matter comparable? to two brothers twins in the same city. One was appointed king, while the other went out to banditry. The king commanded and they hanged Anyone who saw would say: The king hanged. The king, commanded and they took down.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "K'lomar: mipnei mah zeh talui? Mipnei shebeirach ku'. Tanaya, omer Rabbi Meir: mashlu mashal, lema hadavar domeh? Lishnei achim teomim be'irachat. Echad minuhu melech, ve'echad yatza lelisitiyut. Tzivah hamelech uteilauhu. Kol haroeh oto omer: hamelech talui. Tzivah hamelech vehoriduhu." English translation: "That is to say: Why is this hanging? Because it is cursed. It was taught: Rabbi Meir says: They made a parable, what is the matter similar to? To two identical brothers in one city. One of them was made king, and the other went out to banditry. The king commanded and they hanged him. Everyone who sees him says: The king is hanged. The king commanded and they took him down."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי מֵאִיר כּוּ׳. מַאי מַשְׁמַע? אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: כְּמַאן דְּאָמַר ״קַל לֵית״. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא: אִם כֵּן, ״כָּבֵד עָלַי רֹאשִׁי״ ״כָּבֵד עָלַי זְרוֹעִי״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ! אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: כְּמַאן דְּאָמַר ״קִיל לִי עָלְמָא״.
human_translation: Rabbi Meir said From where inferred? Abaye says: like one who said: I am not light [ kal leit ], Rava said to him: If so, he should have My head is heavy for Me, My arm is heavy for Me. Rather, Rava said: like one who said: The world is light for me [ kil li alma ],
llm_translation: Rabbi Meir said: What is the implication? Abaye said: Like one who says "it is not light." Rava said to him: If so, why does it say "let it be heavy upon my head" and "let it be heavy upon my arm"? Rather, Rava said: Like one who says "make the world light for me."

hebrew_text: הַאי מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְגוּפֵהּ? אִם כֵּן, נֵימָא קְרָא ״מְקַלֵּל״. מַאי ״קִלְלַת״? וְאֵימָא: כּוּלֵּיהּ לְהָכִי הוּא דַּאֲתָא? אִם כֵּן, נֵימָא קְרָא ״קַלַּת״. מַאי ״קִלְלַת״? שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ תַּרְתֵּי.
human_translation: This is needed for itself If so, the verse should have stated: One who curses [ mekallel ]. What kilelat ? say the entire comes for this If so, the verse should have stated: Lightness [ kilat ]. What kilelat ? Conclude two from it:
llm_translation: This one requires for itself? If so, let us say the verse "curses." What is "curse"? And let us say: all of it is for this purpose that it came? If so, let us say the verse "lightness." What is "lightness"? Understand from it two.

hebrew_text: וְלֹא זוֹ בִּלְבַד כּוּ׳. אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַי: מִנַּיִן לַמֵּלִין אֶת מֵתוֹ שֶׁעוֹבֵר עָלָיו בְּלֹא תַעֲשֶׂה? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״כִּי קָבוֹר תִּקְבְּרֶנּוּ״. מִכָּאן לַמֵּלִין אֶת מֵתוֹ שֶׁעוֹבֵר בְּלֹא תַעֲשֶׂה.
human_translation: not only Rabbi Yoḥanan says in the name of Rabbi Shimon bar Yoḥai: From where that one who leaves his deceased overnight transgresses a prohibition? The verse states: “But you shall bury him [ kavor tikberennu ]” From here that one who leaves his deceased overnight transgresses a prohibition.
llm_translation: "And not this alone. Rabbi Yohanan said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yohai: From where do we derive that one may circumcise his deceased relative who passes away without fulfilling the commandment? The verse teaches: 'For you shall surely bury him.' From here we learn that one may circumcise his deceased relative who passes away without fulfilling the commandment."

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַי, רֶמֶז לִקְבוּרָה מִן הַתּוֹרָה מִנַּיִין? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״כִּי קָבוֹר תִּקְבְּרֶנּוּ״. מִכָּאן רֶמֶז לִקְבוּרָה מִן הַתּוֹרָה.
human_translation: There are who say Rabbi Yoḥanan says in the name of Rabbi Shimon bar Yoḥai: From where in the Torah is there a hint to burial? The verse states: “But you shall bury him [ kavor tikberennu ],” From here there is a hint to burial in the Torah.
llm_translation: There are those who say: Rabbi Yochanan said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai, a hint to burial from the Torah, from where? The verse states: "For you shall surely bury him." From here is a hint to burial from the Torah.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ שַׁבּוּר מַלְכָּא לְרַב חָמָא: קְבוּרָה מִן הַתּוֹרָה מִנַּיִין? אִישְׁתִּיק וְלָא אֲמַר לֵיהּ וְלָא מִידֵּי. אֲמַר רַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב: אִימְּסַר עָלְמָא בִּידָא דְּטַפְשָׁאֵי, דְּאִיבְּעִי לֵיהּ לְמֵימַר ״כִּי קָבוֹר״.
human_translation: King Shapur, said to Rav Ḥama: From where in the Torah is there a hint to burial? was silent and said nothing to him, Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov said: The world has been handed over to the foolish, as should have said “But you shall bury
llm_translation: He said to him, Shabur the king to Rav Hama: Burial from the Torah from where? He remained silent and did not say to him anything. Rav Acha bar Yaakov said: If it was entrusted to fools, for they would want to say "for burial."

hebrew_text: דְּלֶיעֱבֵד לֵיהּ אָרוֹן. ״תִּקְבְּרֶנּוּ״! לָא מַשְׁמַע לֵיהּ.
human_translation: that a coffin should be made for bury him tikberennu ].” he does not learn
llm_translation: He does not agree with him, "Bury him!" He does not heed him.

hebrew_text: וְנֵימָא: מִדְּאִיקְּבוּר צַדִּיקֵי? מִנְהֲגָא בְּעָלְמָא! מִדְּקַבְרֵיהּ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לְמֹשֶׁה? דְּלָא לִישְׁתַּנֵּי מִמִּנְהֲגָא.
human_translation: But let say from that the righteous were buried. merely a custom from that the Holy One, Blessed be He, buried Moses, in order not to deviate from the custom,
llm_translation: And it was stated: Since when do the righteous require burial? It is the way of the world! Since when does the Holy One, blessed be He, bury Moses? So as not to establish a precedent.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: ״וְסָפְדוּ לוֹ כׇל יִשְׂרָאֵל וְקָבְרוּ אֹתוֹ״. דְּלָא לִישְׁתַּנֵּי מִמִּנְהֲגָא.
human_translation: Come hear “And all Israel shall eulogize him and bury him” in order not to deviate from the custom
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Come and hear: 'And all Israel shall mourn for him and bury him.' For it is not to be distinguished from the customary practice."

hebrew_text: ״לֹא יִסָּפְדוּ וְלֹא יִקָּבֵרוּ לְדֹמֶן עַל פְּנֵי הָאֲדָמָה יִהְיוּ״. דְּלִישְׁתַּנּוֹ מִמִּנְהֲגָא.
human_translation: “They shall not be eulogized, nor shall they be buried; but they shall be as dung upon the face of the earth” that they would deviate from the custom
llm_translation: "They shall not mourn, nor shall they be buried; like dung on the surface of the ground they shall be." This is derived from the custom.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: קְבוּרָה מִשּׁוּם בִּזְיוֹנָא הוּא, אוֹ מִשּׁוּם כַּפָּרָה הוּא?
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before Is burial on account of disgrace, or is it on account of atonement,
llm_translation: He asked them: Is burial due to disgrace, or is it due to atonement?

hebrew_text: לְמַאי נָפְקָא מִינַּהּ? דְּאָמַר: לָא בָּעֵינָא דְּלִיקְבְּרוּהּ לְהָהוּא גַּבְרָא. אִי אָמְרַתְּ מִשּׁוּם בִּזְיוֹנָא הוּא – לָא כֹּל כְּמִינֵּיהּ, וְאִי אָמְרַתְּ מִשּׁוּם כַּפָּרָה הוּא – הָא אָמַר: לָא בָּעֵינָא כַּפָּרָה. מַאי?
human_translation: What is the difference where said I do not want them to bury that man, If you say is on account of disgrace, it is not in his But if you say is on account of atonement, didn’t he say: I do not want atonement, What,
llm_translation: For what purpose did she go out? Because he said: I do not want them to speak about that man. If you say it is because it is a disgrace - not everyone is like him, and if you say it is because it is atonement - but he said: I do not want atonement. What is the reason?

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: מִדְּאִיקְּבוּר צַדִּיקֵי, וְאִי אָמְרַתְּ מִשּׁוּם כַּפָּרָה – צַדִּיקֵי לְכַפָּרָה צְרִיכִי? אִין, דִּכְתִיב: ״אָדָם אֵין צַדִּיק בָּאָרֶץ אֲשֶׁר יַעֲשֶׂה טּוֹב וְלֹא יֶחֱטָא״.
human_translation: Come hear from that the righteous were buried. And if you say on account of atonement, do the righteous need atonement? Yes, as it is written: there is no righteous person on earth who does good and never sins”
llm_translation: Come and hear: Since the righteous are buried, and if you say it is for atonement - do the righteous need atonement? No, as it is written: "There is no righteous man on earth who does good and does not sin."

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: ״וְסָפְדוּ לוֹ כׇל יִשְׂרָאֵל וְקָבְרוּ אֹתוֹ״. וְאִי אָמְרַתְּ, כִּי הֵיכִי דְּתֶיהֱוֵי לֵיהּ כַּפָּרָה, הָנָךְ נָמֵי לִיקַּבְרוּ כִּי הֵיכִי דְּתֶיהֱוֵי לְהוּ כַּפָּרָה? הַאי דְּצַדִּיק הוּא – תֶּיהֱוֵי לֵיהּ כַּפָּרָה, הָנָךְ – לָא לֶיהֱוֵי לְהוּ כַּפָּרָה.
human_translation: Come hear “And all Israel shall eulogize him and bury him, And if you say so that should achieve atonement, these too, should also be buried so that they should achieve atonement. This who was righteous, should achieve atonement these should not achieve atonement
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Come and hear: 'And all Israel shall mourn for him and bury him.' And if you say, how can it be that they should mourn for him and also bury him, how can it be that they should be for atonement? This one, who is a righteous person – it will be for atonement for him, but this one – it will not be for atonement for him."

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: ״לֹא יִסָּפְדוּ וְלֹא יִקָּבֵרוּ״, דְּלָא תֶּיהֱוֵי לְהוּ כַּפָּרָה.
human_translation: Come hear “They shall not be eulogized, nor shall they be buried” that should not achieve atonement.
llm_translation: "Come and hear: 'They shall not lament, nor shall they be buried,' for it shall not be a ransom."

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: הֶסְפֵּידָא, יְקָרָא דְּחָיֵי הָוֵי אוֹ יְקָרָא דְּשָׁכְבֵי הָוֵי? לְמַאי נָפְקָא מִינַּהּ? דְּאָמַר: לָא תִּסְפְּדוּהּ לְהָהוּא גַּבְרָא. אִי נָמֵי, לְאַפּוֹקֵי מִיּוֹרְשִׁין.
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before Is the eulogy the honor of the living or is it the honor of the dead? What is the difference where said Do not eulogize that man, Alternately, to collect from the heirs.
llm_translation: He asked them: In the case of a eulogy, should it be the honor of the living or the honor of the deceased? What practical difference does it make? For it was said: Do not eulogize him in the presence of that man. Alternatively, it is to avoid confrontations with the heirs.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: ״וַיָּבֹא אַבְרָהָם לִסְפֹּד לְשָׂרָה וְלִבְכֹּתָהּ״. וְאִי אָמְרַתְּ מִשּׁוּם יְקָרָא דְּחַיֵּי הוּא, מִשּׁוּם יְקָרָא דְּאַבְרָהָם מְשַׁהוּ לַהּ לְשָׂרָה? שָׂרָה גּוּפַהּ נִיחָא לָהּ, כִּי הֵיכִי דְּמִיַּיקַּר בַּהּ אַבְרָהָם.
human_translation: Come hear “And Abraham came to eulogize Sarah and weep over her” And if you say due to the honor of the living, would they have delayed Sarah due to Abraham’s honor? It was satisfactory to Sarah herself so that Abraham could be honored by her.
llm_translation: "Come and hear: 'And Abraham came to eulogize Sarah and to weep for her.' And if you say it is because of the preciousness of the living, is it because of the preciousness of Abraham that he should eulogize Sarah? Sarah's own body was precious to her, so that Abraham should show her honor."

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: ״וְסָפְדוּ לוֹ כׇל יִשְׂרָאֵל וְקָבְרוּ אֹתוֹ״. וְאִי אָמְרַתְּ מִשּׁוּם יְקָרָא דְּחַיֵּי הוּא, הָנָךְ בְּנֵי יְקָרָא נִינְהוּ? נִיחָא לְהוּ לְצַדִּיקַיָּא דְּמִיַּיקְּרִי בְּהוּ אִינָשֵׁי.
human_translation: Come hear “And all Israel shall eulogize him and bury him” And if you say is due to the honor of the living, are these worthy of honor? It is satisfactory to the righteous when people are honored through them.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Come and hear: 'And all Israel shall mourn for him and bury him.' But if you say it is because he is honorable, are those the sons of honorable ones? It is fitting for the righteous that people honor them."

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: ״לֹא יִסָּפְדוּ וְלֹא יִקָּבֵרוּ״. לָא נִיחָא לְצַדִּיקַיָּא דְּמִיַּיקְּרִי בַּרְשִׁיעִיָּיא.
human_translation: Come hear “They shall not be eulogized, nor shall they be buried” It is not satisfactory to the righteous when they are honored through the wicked,
llm_translation: "Come and hear: 'They shall not mourn, nor shall they be buried.' It is not appropriate for the righteous who are called wicked."

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: ״בְּשָׁלוֹם תָּמוּת וּבְמִשְׂרְפוֹת אֲבוֹתֶיךָ הַמְּלָכִים הָרִאשׁוֹנִים אֲשֶׁר הָיוּ לְפָנֶיךָ כֵּן יִשְׂרְפוּ לָךְ וְהוֹי אָדוֹן יִסְפְּדוּ לָךְ״. וְאִי אָמְרַתְּ מִשּׁוּם יְקָרָא דְּחָיֵי הוּא, מַאי נָפְקָא לֵיהּ מִינֵּיהּ? הָכִי קָאָמַר לֵיהּ: לִיַּיקְּרוּ בָּיךְ יִשְׂרָאֵל כִּי הֵיכִי דְּמִתְיַיקְּרִי בַּאֲבָהָתָךְ.
human_translation: Come hear “You shall die in peace; and with the burnings of your fathers, the former kings that were before you, so shall they make a burning for you; and they will eulogize you, saying: Ah, master” And if you say is due to the honor of the living what difference does it make to him this is saying to Israel shall be honored through you as they were honored through your ancestors
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Ta shma: 'Beshalom tamut uvmisrefot avotecha hamelachim harishonim asher hayu lefanecha, ken yisrefu lakh vehoi adon yispedu lakh.' Ve'ei amarta mishum yekara dechaye hu, mai nafka leih? Hachi ka'amar leih: Liyaikru bach Yisrael ki heichi demityaikri b'avahatach." English translation: "Come and hear: 'You shall die in peace, and with the burnings of your fathers, the former kings who were before you, so shall they burn for you, and they shall mourn for you.' And if you say it is because he is precious in life, what benefit does he derive from it? Thus he said to him: Let Israel be precious to you, just as you are precious to your father."

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: ״נִבְזֶה בְּעֵינָיו נִמְאָס״ – זֶה חִזְקִיָּהוּ מֶלֶךְ יְהוּדָה, שֶׁגֵּירַר עַצְמוֹת אָבִיו עַל מִטָּה שֶׁל חֲבָלִים. וְאִי מִשּׁוּם יְקָרָא דְחַיֵּי הוּא, מַאי טַעְמָא?
human_translation: Come hear “In his eyes a vile person is despised, This Hezekiah, king of Judea, who dragged the bones of his father, on a bier of ropes, And if to honor the living, what is the reason
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Come and hear: 'Despised in his eyes, rejected' - this is Hezekiah, king of Judah, who dragged the bones of his father on a bed of ropes. And if due to the preciousness of life, what is the reason?"

hebrew_text: כִּי הֵיכִי דְּתִיהְוֵי לֵיהּ כַּפָּרָה לַאֲבוּהּ, וּמִשּׁוּם כַּפָּרָה דַּאֲבוּהּ מְשַׁהוּ לֵיהּ לִיקָרָא דְיִשְׂרָאֵל? יִשְׂרָאֵל גּוּפַיְיהוּ נִיחָא לְהוּ דְּמַחֲלִי יְקָרַיְיהוּ לְגַבֵּיהּ.
human_translation: so that his father would achieve atonement for his father’s atonement they would defer the honor of Israel, It was satisfactory to Israel themselves to forgo their honor for him
llm_translation: In this way, that it should be considered as atonement for his father, and because of the atonement of his father, something of honor is attributed to him as a member of the community of Israel? The Israelites themselves prefer that their esteemed ones forgive their honor to others.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, אָמַר לָהֶן: אַל תִּסְפְּדוּנִי בָּעֲיָירוֹת. וְאִי אָמְרַתְּ יְקָרָא דְחַיֵּי, מַאי נָפְקָא לֵיהּ מִינַּהּ? קָסָבַר: לִיתְיַיקְּרוּ בֵּיהּ יִשְׂרָאֵל טְפֵי.
human_translation: Come hear said to Do not eulogize me in the towns And if you say in honor of the living, what difference does it make to him He thought Israel would be more honored through him
llm_translation: Come and hear, he said to them: Do not eulogize me in the cities. And if you say, "The honor of the living," what benefit does he derive from it? He holds: Let the children of Israel honor him.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: הֱלִינוֹ לִכְבוֹדוֹ, לְהָבִיא לוֹ אָרוֹן וְתַכְרִיכִין – אֵינוֹ עוֹבֵר עָלָיו. מַאי לָאו לִכְבוֹדוֹ שֶׁל מֵת? לֹא, לִכְבוֹדוֹ שֶׁל חַי.
human_translation: Come hear one left overnight for the sake of his honor, to bring him a coffin or shrouds, he does not transgress What, is it not the honor of the deceased? No, to the honor of the living
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Ta shma: helino lichvodo, lehaavi lo aron ve'tachrichin - einu over alav. Mai lav lichvodo shel met? Lo, lichvodo shel chai." English translation: "Come and hear: If they carried it for his honor, to bring him an ark and shrouds - they do not transgress. What, is it not for the honor of the deceased? No, for the honor of the living."

hebrew_text: וּמִשּׁוּם כְּבוֹדוֹ שֶׁל חַי מֵבִית לֵיהּ לְמֵת? אִין, כִּי אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא: ״לֹא תָלִין נִבְלָתוֹ עַל הָעֵץ״, דּוּמְיָא דְּתָלוּי דְּאִית בֵּיהּ בִּזָּיוֹן. אֲבָל הָכָא, כֵּיוָן דְּלֵית בֵּיהּ בִּזָּיוֹן – לָא.
human_translation: But due to the honor of the living, they allow the deceased to remain overnight? Yes, when the Merciful One states: “His body shall not remain all night upon the tree, similar to of hung who suffers degradation But here, since does not suffer degradation no
llm_translation: And because of the honor of the living, one may not remove a carcass from the house for a dead person? No, for the Merciful One said: "His carcass shall not remain overnight upon the tree," similar to a hanging corpse that has disgrace in it. But here, since there is no disgrace in it - no.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: הֱלִינוֹ לִכְבוֹדוֹ, לְשַׁמֵּעַ עָלָיו עֲיָירוֹת, לְהָבִיא לוֹ מְקוֹנְנוֹת, לְהָבִיא לוֹ אָרוֹן וְתַכְרִיכִין – אֵינוֹ עוֹבֵר עָלָיו, שֶׁכׇּל הָעוֹשֶׂה אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא לִכְבוֹדוֹ שֶׁל מֵת. הָכִי קָאָמַר: כׇּל הָעוֹשֶׂה לִכְבוֹדוֹ שֶׁל חַי, אֵין בּוֹ בִּזָּיוֹן לַמֵּת.
human_translation: Come hear one left overnight for the sake of his honor, to assemble the towns for to bring him lamenters, to bring him a coffin or shrouds, he does not transgress as anyone who acts only for honoring the dead. This is saying: Anyone who acts for honoring the living there is no degradation of the dead.
llm_translation: Come and hear: If one prepares for his honor, to hear about him in the cities, to bring him cushions, to bring him a coffin and shrouds - he does not transgress, for all that he does is only for the honor of the deceased. This is what it means: Anyone who does for the honor of the living, there is no disrespect to the dead.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, רַבִּי נָתָן אוֹמֵר: סִימָן יָפֶה לַמֵּת שֶׁנִּפְרָעִין מִמֶּנּוּ לְאַחַר מִיתָה. מֵת שֶׁלֹּא נִסְפַּד וְלֹא נִקְבַּר, אוֹ שֶׁחַיָּה גּוֹרַרְתּוֹ, אוֹ שֶׁהָיוּ גְּשָׁמִים מְזַלְּפִין עַל מִטָּתוֹ – זֶהוּ סִימָן יָפֶה לַמֵּת. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: יְקָרָא דְשָׁכְבֵי הוּא. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Come hear Rabbi Natan says: a good sign for the deceased when he is punished after death the deceased was not eulogized, or he was not buried, or a wild animal dragged his or rain fell on his bier, this is a good sign for the deceased. Learn from is the honor of the dead, Learn from
llm_translation: Come and hear, Rabbi Natan says: A good sign for the deceased is when they are avenged after their death. If a person dies without being eulogized or buried, or if a living person drags their body, or if rain falls on their bed - this is a good sign for the deceased. Learn from this: "Precious in the eyes of the Lord is the death of His pious ones." Learn from this.

hebrew_text: לֹא הָיוּ קוֹבְרִין כּוּ׳. וְכׇל כָּךְ לָמָּה? לְפִי שֶׁאֵין קוֹבְרִין רָשָׁע אֵצֶל צַדִּיק, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אַחָא בַּר חֲנִינָא: מִנַּיִן שֶׁאֵין קוֹבְרִין רָשָׁע אֵצֶל צַדִּיק? שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיְהִי הֵם קֹבְרִים אִישׁ וְהִנֵּה רָאוּ אֶת הַגְּדוּד וַיַּשְׁלִיכוּ אֶת הָאִישׁ בְּקֶבֶר אֱלִישָׁע וַיִּגַּע הָאִישׁ בְּעַצְמוֹת אֱלִישָׁע וַיְחִי וַיָּקׇם עַל רַגְלָיו״.
human_translation: they would not bury And why all this because a wicked man is not buried next to a righteous man. As Rav Aḥa bar Ḥanina says: From where that a wicked man is not buried next to a righteous man? As it is stated: “And it came to pass, as they were burying a man, that behold, they spied a raiding party; and they cast the man into the tomb of Elisha; and the man he touched the bones of Elisha, and he revived and stood up on his feet”
llm_translation: They did not bury him. And why all this? Because they do not bury a wicked person next to a righteous person, as Rabbi Ahah bar Hanina said: From where do we know that they do not bury a wicked person next to a righteous person? As it is stated: "And it came to pass, as they were burying a man, that, behold, they spied a band; and they cast the man into the sepulcher of Elisha; and as soon as the man touched the bones of Elisha, he revived, and stood up on his feet."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב פָּפָּא: וְדִילְמָא לְאִיקְּיוֹמֵי ״וִיהִי נָא פִּי שְׁנַיִם בְּרוּחֲךָ אֵלָי״? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִי הָכִי, הַיְינוּ דְּתַנְיָא: עַל רַגְלָיו עָמַד, וּלְבֵיתוֹ לֹא הָלַךְ.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said to Perhaps to fulfill “I pray you, let a double portion of your spirit be upon me” said to If so, is this what is taught he arose, but he did not go to his home.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Papa: "But perhaps it should be interpreted as 'And let now two mouths speak to you in your spirit'?" He said to him: If so, this is what was taught: "He stood on his feet, but did not go to his house."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא ״וִיהִי נָא פִּי שְׁנַיִם״, הֵיכִי מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ דְּאַחֲיֵיא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: שֶׁרִיפֵּא צָרַעַת נַעֲמָן, שֶׁהִיא שְׁקוּלָה כְּמֵת, דִּכְתִיב ״אַל נָא תְהִי כַּמֵּת״.
human_translation: But “I pray you, let a double portion where do you find that resurrected Rabbi Yoḥanan said to him: when he cured Naaman’s leprosy that is equivalent to death, as it is written “Let her not be as one dead”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rather, "And now let my two lips be silent," how do you find that it is fulfilled? Rabbi Yochanan said to him: The healing of Naaman's leprosy, which is considered as difficult as reviving the dead, as it is written, "Let not my lord be like one dead." English translation:

hebrew_text: וּכְשֵׁם שֶׁאֵין קוֹבְרִין רָשָׁע אֵצֶל צַדִּיק, כָּךְ אֵין קוֹבְרִין רָשָׁע חָמוּר אֵצֶל רָשָׁע קַל. וְלִיתְקוֹן אַרְבַּע קְבָרוֹת! שְׁנֵי קְבָרוֹת גְּמָרָא גְּמִירִי לַהּ.
human_translation: Just as a wicked man is not buried next to a righteous man, so an extremely wicked man, is not buried next to a less wicked man, let them establish four graveyards, is learned as a tradition two graveyards
llm_translation: And as just as not bury wicked next to righteous, so not bury wicked severe next to wicked light. And to fix four graves! Two graves Gemara Gemiri to it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר עוּלָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אָכַל חֵלֶב וְהִפְרִישׁ קׇרְבָּן, וְהִשְׁתַּמֵּד וְחָזַר בּוֹ – הוֹאִיל וְנִדְחָה, יִדָּחֶה.
human_translation: Ulla says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: ate fat and separated an offering and became an apostate and subsequently retracted since was rejected it shall rejected.
llm_translation: Ula said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: If one ate forbidden fat and set aside an offering, and then regretted it and consumed it again - since it was already disqualified, it shall be disqualified.

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר נָמֵי, אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אָכַל חֵלֶב וְהִפְרִישׁ קׇרְבָּן, וְנִשְׁתַּטָּה, וְחָזַר וְנִשְׁתַּפָּה – הוֹאִיל וְנִדְחָה, יִדָּחֶה.
human_translation: It was also stated Rabbi Yirmeya says Rabbi Abbahu says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: ate fat and separated an offering and became insane, and regained his sanity, Since was rejected it shall rejected.
llm_translation: It was stated: Naḥmei said, Rabbi Yirmeya said, Rabbi Avahu said, Rabbi Yoḥanan said: If one ate forbidden fat and separated an offering, and became confused, and then remembered and separated it again – since it was disqualified, it shall be disqualified.

hebrew_text: וּצְרִיכָא, דְּאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן קַמַּיְיתָא – מִשּׁוּם דְּאִיהוּ דְּחָה נַפְשֵׁיהּ בְּיָדַיִם, אֲבָל הַאי דְּמִמֵּילָא קָא דָחֵי – אֵימָא כְּיָשֵׁן דָּמֵי.
human_translation: And was necessary As, had he taught us the first because actively rejected himself But this where was rejected automatically, I would say is considered as one who is asleep,
llm_translation: And it is necessary, for if we were to hear the first case - because he himself caused his own life to be in danger, but this one who is pushed by others - we might say it is as if he were asleep.

hebrew_text: וְאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן הָכָא, מִשּׁוּם דְּאֵין בְּיָדוֹ לַחְזוֹר, אֲבָל הָתָם דִּבְיָדוֹ לַחְזוֹר, אֵימָא לָא. צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: And had he taught us this because it was not in power to regain But there, who has the power to retract I would say not necessary
llm_translation: "And if we were to hear here, because he cannot retract, but there, where he can retract, let us say no. This is necessary."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: אַף אֲנַן נָמֵי תְּנֵינָא, הָיוּ בָּהּ קֳדָשִׁים, קׇדְשֵׁי מִזְבֵּחַ יָמוּתוּ, קׇדְשֵׁי בֶּדֶק הַבַּיִת יִפָּדוּ. וְהָוֵינַן בַּהּ: אַמַּאי יָמוּתוּ? כֵּיוָן דְּאִיקְּטוּל הָוְיָא לְהוּ כַּפָּרָה, וְלִיסְּקוּ לְגָבוֹהַּ! לָאו מִשּׁוּם דְּאָמְרִינַן: הוֹאִיל וְנִדְחוּ, יִדָּחוּ?
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: We, too, learn consecrated were in consecrated to the altar must be left to die, consecrated for Temple maintenance may be redeemed And we discussed it: Why must die? Once are killed, they achieve atonement, and to sacrifice to the Most High. Is it not because we say: Since they were rejected they rejected
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: We also learned, if they were sanctified in it, the holy things of the altar will die, the holy things of the Temple courtyard will be redeemed. And we were in it: Why will they die? Since they were designated for atonement, and they were raised up! Not because we say: Since they were rejected, let them be rejected?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: מִי סָבְרַתְּ מֵת מִתּוֹךְ רִשְׁעוֹ הָוְיָא לֵיהּ כַּפָּרָה? מֵת מִתּוֹךְ רִשְׁעוֹ לָא הָוְיָא לֵיהּ כַּפָּרָה, דְּתָנֵי רַב שְׁמַעְיָה: יָכוֹל אֲפִילּוּ פֵּירְשׁוּ אֲבוֹתָיו מִדַּרְכֵי צִיבּוּר יִטַּמֵּא? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״בְּעַמָּיו״ – בְּעוֹשֶׂה מַעֲשֵׂה עַמָּיו.
human_translation: Abaye said to Do you maintain one who dies in his wickedness achieves atonement? one who dies in his wickedness does not achieve atonement, as Rav Shemaya taught might even if his father separated himself from the ways of the community, shall become ritually impure the verse states: “Among his people,” for one who performs the actions of his people,
llm_translation: He said to him, Abaye: Who holds that if one dies due to his wickedness, it would be considered atonement for him? If one dies due to his wickedness, it would not be considered atonement for him, as Rav Shemaya teaches: Is it possible that even if his ancestors departed from the ways of the community, he would become impure? The verse teaches, "Among his people" - for one who acts like his people.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא: מִי קָא מְדַמֵּית נֶהֱרָג מִתּוֹךְ רִשְׁעוֹ לְמֵת מִתּוֹךְ רִשְׁעוֹ? מֵת מִתּוֹךְ רִשְׁעוֹ, כֵּיוָן דְּכִי אוֹרְחֵיהּ קָמָיֵית – לָא הָוְיָא לֵיהּ כַּפָּרָה. נֶהֱרָג מִתּוֹךְ רִשְׁעוֹ, כֵּיוָן דְּלָאו כִּי אוֹרְחֵיהּ מָיֵית – הָוְיָא לֵיהּ כַּפָּרָה.
human_translation: Rava said to Are you comparing one who was killed in his wickedness to one who died in his wickedness? who died in his wickedness does not achieve atonement, since he died a natural death who was killed in his wickedness achieves atonement, since he did not die a natural death,
llm_translation: He said to him, Rava: Who is considered as if he were killed from within his wickedness to the point of being considered dead from within his wickedness? If he died from within his wickedness, since his ways were established, he would not have atonement. If he was killed from within his wickedness, since his ways were not established, he would have atonement.

hebrew_text: תִּדַּע, דִּכְתִיב: מִזְמוֹר לְאָסָף אֱלֹהִים בָּאוּ גוֹיִם בְּנַחֲלָתֶךָ טִמְּאוּ אֶת הֵיכַל קׇדְשֶׁךָ [וְגוֹ׳] נָתְנוּ אֶת נִבְלַת עֲבָדֶיךָ מַאֲכָל לְעוֹף הַשָּׁמָיִם בְּשַׂר חֲסִידֶיךָ לְחַיְתוֹ אָרֶץ״. מַאי ״עֲבָדֶיךָ״ וּמַאי ״חֲסִידֶיךָ״? לָאו ״חֲסִידֶיךָ״ – חֲסִידֶיךָ מַמָּשׁ, ״עֲבָדֶיךָ״ – הָנָךְ דִּמְחַיְּיבִי דִּינָא דְּמֵעִיקָּרָא, וְכֵיוָן דְּאִיקְּטוּל קָרֵי לְהוּ ״עֲבָדֶיךָ״.
human_translation: Know as it is written: “A song to Asaf. O God, nations are come into Your inheritance; they have defiled your Holy Temple; The dead bodies of Your servants they have given to be food to the birds of the sky, the flesh of Your pious ones to the beasts of the earth” What “Your servants” and what “Your pious ones”? Is it not “Your pious ones” literally, Your pious ones, “Your servants” those who had initially been liable to punishment but once they were killed, they are called “Your servants”?
llm_translation: You should know, as it is written: "A Psalm of Asaph. O God, the nations have come into Your inheritance; they have defiled Your holy temple, they have laid Jerusalem in ruins. They have given the dead bodies of Your servants as food to the birds of the heavens, the flesh of Your pious ones to the beasts of the earth." What is meant by "Your servants" and what is meant by "Your pious ones"? Not "Your pious ones" - your actual pious ones; "Your servants" - those who are liable to the judgment from the very beginning, and since they were killed, they are called "Your servants."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: מִי קָא מְדַמֵּית
human_translation: Abaye said to Rava: Are you comparing
llm_translation: He said to him, Abaye: Who is comparing?

hebrew_text: הֲרוּגֵי מַלְכוּת לַהֲרוּגֵי בֵּית דִּין? הֲרוּגֵי מַלְכוּת, כֵּיוָן דְּשֶׁלֹּא בְּדִין קָא מִיקַּטְלִי, הָוְיָא לְהוּ כַּפָּרָה. הֲרוּגֵי בֵּית דִּין, כֵּיוָן דִּבְדִין קָא מִיקַּטְלִי, לָא הָוֵי לְהוּ כַּפָּרָה.
human_translation: those killed by government to those killed by court? Those who were killed by government, since they were killed unjustly, achieve atonement those who were killed by court, since they were killed justly do not achieve atonement
llm_translation: The slain of the kingdom for the slain of the court? The slain of the kingdom, since they are not killed by the court, it is considered atonement for them. The slain of the court, since they are killed by the court, it is not considered atonement for them.

hebrew_text: תֵּדַע, דִּתְנַן: לֹא הָיוּ קוֹבְרִין אוֹתוֹ בְּקִבְרוֹת אֲבוֹתָיו. וְאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ, כֵּיוָן דְּאִיקְּטוּל הָוְיָא לְהוּ כַּפָּרָה, לִיקַּבְרוּ! מִיתָה וּקְבוּרָה בָּעֵינַן.
human_translation: Know as we have learned They would not bury in his ancestral plot. And if it enters your mind once are executed they achieve atonement, let them be buried death and burial are needed.
llm_translation: You should know, as we learned: They did not bury him in the graves of his forefathers. And if you were to suggest otherwise, since he was an apostate, they should have buried him! We require both death and burial.

hebrew_text: מוֹתֵיב רַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה: לָא הָיוּ מִתְאַבְּלִין, אֶלָּא אוֹנְנִין, שֶׁאֵין אֲנִינוּת אֶלָּא בַּלֵּב. וְאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ, כֵּיוָן דְּאִיקְּבוּר הָוְיָא לְהוּ כַּפָּרָה – לִיאַבְּלוּ!
human_translation: Rav Adda bar Ahava raised an objection would not mourn but they would grieve since grief is only in the heart. And if it enters your mind once are buried they achieve atonement, let mourn
llm_translation: Rav Adda bar Ahava raises an objection: They were not mourning, but rather expressing onenut, for there is no aninut except in the heart. And if you disagree, since they were already buried, it should be a time for kefara - they should mourn!

hebrew_text: בָּעֵינַן נָמֵי עִיכּוּל בָּשָׂר. דַּיְקָא נָמֵי, דְּקָתָנֵי: נִתְעַכֵּל הַבָּשָׂר – מְלַקְּטִין אֶת הָעֲצָמוֹת וְקוֹבְרִין אוֹתָן בִּמְקוֹמָן. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: decomposition of is needed. is also precise, as it teaches: the flesh had decomposed, they would gather bones and bury them in their place Learn from
llm_translation: We require the fat of the meat. Specifically, we require, as it was taught: if the meat has spoiled - we gather the bones and bury them in their place. Learn from this.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: אֲבֵילוּת מֵאֵימָתַי קָא מַתְחֲלָא? מִסְּתִימַת הַגּוֹלֵל. כַּפָּרָה מֵאֵימָתַי קָא הָוְיָא? מִכִּי חָזוּ צַעֲרָא דְקִבְרָא פּוּרְתָּא. הִלְכָּךְ, הוֹאִיל וְנִדְחוּ יִדָּחוּ.
human_translation: Rav Ashi says When does mourning commence? from the sealing of the grave cover. when is atonement when see a bit of the anguish of the grave. Consequently, since were set aside they set aside,
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: From when does mourning begin? From the closing of the scroll. From when does atonement occur? When they see the shovel at the grave. Therefore, if they are rejected, they shall be rejected.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, לְמָה לִי עִיכּוּל בָּשָׂר? מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא אֶפְשָׁר.
human_translation: If so, why do I decomposition of flesh Because it is impossible
llm_translation: If so, why do I need the prohibition of eating meat? Because it is not possible.

hebrew_text: קִבְרֵיהּ דְּרַב הֲווֹ שָׁקְלִי מִינֵּיהּ עַפְרָא לְאִישָּׁתָא בַּת יוֹמָא. אֲתוֹ אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ לִשְׁמוּאֵל. אֲמַר לְהוּ: יָאוּת עָבְדִין, קַרְקַע עוֹלָם הוּא, וְקַרְקַע עוֹלָם אֵינָהּ נֶאֱסֶרֶת, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיַּשְׁלֵךְ אֶת עֲפָרָהּ עַל קֶבֶר בְּנֵי הָעָם״, מַקִּישׁ קֶבֶר בְּנֵי הָעָם לַעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה.
human_translation: would take dirt from the grave of Rav for a one-day fever. came and told Shmuel said to them: are acting properly, as is natural ground, and natural ground does not become forbidden as it is written: and cast the dust of it upon the graves of the common people” juxtaposes the graves of the common people to idol worship.
llm_translation: The grave of Rav, they would take handfuls of its dust to a menstruating woman. They came and told this to Shmuel. He said to them: You have done well, it is ordinary earth, and ordinary earth is not prohibited, as it is written: "And he cast her dust upon the graves of the common people," equating the graves of the common people to idol worship.

hebrew_text: מָה עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה בִּמְחוּבָּר לָא מִיתַּסְרָא, דִּכְתִיב: ״אֲשֶׁר אַתֶּם יֹרְשִׁים אֹתָם אֶת אֱלֹהֵיהֶם עַל הֶהָרִים הָרָמִים״. עַל הֶהָרִים אֱלֹהֵיהֶם, וְלֹא הֶהָרִים אֱלֹהֵיהֶם. הָכָא נָמֵי, בִּמְחוּבָּר לָא מִיתְּסַר.
human_translation: just as idol worship are not forbidden when attached As it is written: whom you are to dispossess served their gods, upon the high mountains, their gods upon the mountains, but no the mountains their gods, Here too, that is attached does not become forbidden.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: What is the status of foreign worship in a mixture, it does not become prohibited, as it is written: "Whom you inherit their gods upon the lofty mountains." Their gods upon the mountains, and not the mountains their gods. Here too, in a mixture, it does not become prohibited.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: הַחוֹצֵב קֶבֶר לְאָבִיו, וְהָלַךְ וּקְבָרוֹ בְּמָקוֹם אַחֵר – הֲרֵי זֶה לֹא יִקָּבֵר בּוֹ עוֹלָמִית. הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן? בְּקֶבֶר בִּנְיָן.
human_translation: raises an objection one hews a grave for his father and goes and buries him in a different place, may never be buried in With what are we dealing here? with a cave that was constructed
llm_translation: Challenger: One who digs a grave for his father, and then goes and buries him in a different place - this one shall not be buried in it eternally. What are we dealing with here? With a built grave.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: קֶבֶר חָדָשׁ מוּתָּר בַּהֲנָאָה. הֵטִיל בּוֹ נֵפֶל – אָסוּר בַּהֲנָאָה. הָכָא נָמֵי, בְּקֶבֶר בִּנְיָן.
human_translation: Come hear a fresh grave permitted to benefit a non-viable newborn was cast into it, prohibited from benefit Here too, to a grave that was constructed
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Ta shema: kever chadash mutar ba'hana'ah. Hetil bo nevel – asur ba'hana'ah. Hacha namei, be'kever binyan." English translation: "Come and hear: A new grave is permitted for benefit. If a corpse is placed in it – it is prohibited for benefit. Here too, in a grave there is construction."

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: נִמְצָא אַתָּה אוֹמֵר שָׁלֹשׁ קְבָרוֹת הֵן – קֶבֶר הַנִּמְצָא, קֶבֶר הַיָּדוּעַ, קֶבֶר הַמַּזִּיק אֶת הָרַבִּים. קֶבֶר הַנִּמְצָא – מוּתָּר לְפַנּוֹתוֹ. פִּינָּהוּ – מְקוֹמוֹ טָהוֹר וּמוּתָּר בַּהֲנָאָה.
human_translation: Come hear It turns out you say there are three graves, found grave, a known grave, a grave that causes damage to the public. found grave, one is permitted to remove he has removed the place of is ritually pure and permitted to benefit
llm_translation: Come and hear: You say there are three types of graves - an unknown grave, a known grave, and a grave that harms the public. An unknown grave - one may turn it over. Its corner - its place is pure and permitted for benefit.

hebrew_text: קֶבֶר הַיָּדוּעַ, אָסוּר לְפַנּוֹתוֹ. פִּינָּהוּ – מְקוֹמוֹ טָמֵא וְאָסוּר בַּהֲנָאָה.
human_translation: a known grave, prohibited to remove removed the place ritually impure and prohibited to derive benefit
llm_translation: The known grave, it is forbidden to turn it over. Its corner - its place is impure and forbidden for benefit.

hebrew_text: קֶבֶר הַמַּזִּיק אֶת הָרַבִּים, מוּתָּר לְפַנּוֹתוֹ. פִּינָּהוּ – מְקוֹמוֹ טָהוֹר וְאָסוּר בַּהֲנָאָה. הָכָא נָמֵי, בְּקֶבֶר בִּנְיָן.
human_translation: a grave that causes damage to the public, one is permitted to remove he has removed the place is ritually pure, but prohibited to derive benefit Here too, to a grave that was constructed
llm_translation: The grave that harms the public, it is permitted to turn it. Its corner - its place is pure and forbidden for benefit. Here we say, in a grave building.

hebrew_text: וְקֶבֶר הַנִּמְצָא מוּתָּר לְפַנּוֹתוֹ? דִּילְמָא מֵת מִצְוָה הוּא, וּמֵת מִצְוָה קָנָה מְקוֹמוֹ! שָׁאנֵי מֵת מִצְוָה, דְּקָלָא אִית לֵיהּ.
human_translation: found grave, permitted to remove perhaps this is a corpse with no one to bury it [ met mitzva ]. And a met mitzva acquires its place, A met mitzva is different, as it generates publicity.
llm_translation: And a grave that is found, is it permitted to turn it over? Perhaps it is a mitzvah to bury it, and a mitzvah to bury acquires its place! It is different with a mitzvah to bury, as it has a lightness.

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר: הָאוֹרֵג בֶּגֶד לַמֵּת, אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: אָסוּר, וְרָבָא אָמַר: מוּתָּר.
human_translation: It was stated one who weaves a garment for one who died, Abaye says: prohibited And Rava says: permitted
llm_translation: It was stated: One who weaves a garment for the deceased, Abbaye said: forbidden, and Rava said: permitted.

hebrew_text: אַבָּיֵי אָמַר אָסוּר – הַזְמָנָה מִלְּתָא הִיא. וְרָבָא אָמַר מוּתָּר – הַזְמָנָה לָאו מִילְּתָא הִיא.
human_translation: Abaye says prohibited designation is matter, And Rava says permitted, designation is nothing,
llm_translation: Abbaye said: Forbidden - it is a matter of summons. And Rava said: Permitted - summons is not a matter.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּאַבָּיֵי? גָּמַר ״שָׁם״ ״שָׁם״ מֵעֶגְלָה עֲרוּפָה. מָה עֶגְלָה עֲרוּפָה בְּהַזְמָנָה מִיתַּסְרָא, הַאי נָמֵי בְּהַזְמָנָה מִיתַּסְרָא.
human_translation: What is the reasoning of Abaye? He derives “there” from “there” a heifer whose neck is broken. Just as becomes prohibited a heifer whose neck is broken through designation, here too, becomes prohibited through designation.
llm_translation: What is the reason for Abbaye's statement? He derived "there" "there" from a decapitated calf. Just as a decapitated calf is disqualified for the zimmun, so too this one is disqualified for the zimmun.

hebrew_text: וְרָבָא גָּמַר ״שָׁם״ ״שָׁם״ מֵעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה. מָה עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה בְּהַזְמָנָה לָא מִיתַּסְרָא, אַף הָכָא נָמֵי בְּהַזְמָנָה לָא מִיתַּסְרָא.
human_translation: And Rava derives “there” from “there” idol worship. Just as does not become prohibited idol worship through designation, so too, here does not become prohibited through designation.
llm_translation: Rava concluded: "There" "there" is from idol worship. Just as idol worship is not subject to time-bound obligations, so too here, with regard to time-bound obligations, it is not subject.

hebrew_text: וְרָבָא, מַאי טַעְמָא לָא גָּמַר מֵעֶגְלָה עֲרוּפָה? אָמַר לָךְ:
human_translation: And Rava, what is the reason he does not derive from a heifer whose neck is broken? said to you:
llm_translation: Rava, what is the reason he did not complete from the Eglah Arufah? He said to you:

hebrew_text: מְשַׁמְּשִׁין מִמְּשַׁמְּשִׁין גָּמְרִינַן, לְאַפּוֹקֵי עֶגְלָה עֲרוּפָה דְּהִיא גּוּפַהּ קְדוֹשָׁה.
human_translation: We derive the accessories from accessories to the exclusion of a heifer whose neck is broken, which is itself consecrated
llm_translation: We serve from those who serve, we finish, to the outskirts of the calf that is mixed, which is its body holy.

hebrew_text: וְאַבָּיֵי, מַאי טַעְמָא לָא גָּמַר מֵעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה? אָמַר לָךְ: מִידֵּי דְּאוֹרְחֵיהּ מִמִּידֵּי דְּאוֹרְחֵיהּ גָּמְרִינַן, לְאַפּוֹקֵי עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה דְּלָאו אוֹרְחָא.
human_translation: And Abaye, what is the reason he did not derive from idol worship? said to you we learn something that way from something that way to the exclusion of idol worship, which do not way
llm_translation: And Abbaye, what is the reason he did not complete the foreign service? He said to you: Because we learn from his ways, we learn from his ways, to avoid foreign service that is not his way.

hebrew_text: סִימָן: כִּפָּה, נַפְשֵׁיהּ, דַּחֲצִיבָא, בְּקִבְרֵיהּ דְּיַתִּיר מֵאֲבֻהּ, בְּכִיסָא דְּאוּמָּנָא.
human_translation: a mnemonic Scarf; monument; that was hewed; pouch; craftsman.
llm_translation: Tractate: Kippah, Nafsheih, Dachatziba, in its grave that is more than its father, in the bag of a craftsman.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: כִּפָּה שֶׁהוּא טָמֵא מִדְרָס וּנְתָנַתּוּ לְסֵפֶר – טָהוֹר מִן הַמִּדְרָס, אֲבָל טָמֵא מַגַּע מִדְרָס. אֵימָא: נְתָנַתּוּ וּכְרָכַתּוּ.
human_translation: raises an objection a scarf is ritually impure treading, and designated it for scroll, pure of treading, But impure by touching that which is treaded upon. Say designated it and wrapped it
llm_translation: Challenger: If a spoon that is impure from a couch is placed on a book - it is pure from the couch, but impure from touching the couch. I might say: If it was placed and wrapped in the book.

hebrew_text: לְמָה לִי נְתָנַתּוּ וּכְרָכַתּוּ? כִּדְרַב חִסְדָּא, דְּאָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: הַאי סוּדָרָא דְּאַזְמְנֵיהּ לְמֵיצַר בֵּיהּ תְּפִילִּין, וְצַר בֵּיהּ תְּפִילִּין – אָסוּר לְמֵיצַר בֵּיהּ פְּשִׁיטֵי. אַזְמְנֵיהּ וְלָא צַר בֵּיהּ, צַר בֵּיהּ וְלָא אַזְמְנֵיהּ – שְׁרֵי לְמֵיצַר בֵּיהּ פְּשִׁיטֵי.
human_translation: why do I designated it and wrapped it? in accordance with of Rav Ḥisda, as Rav Ḥisda says: this cloth that one designated for bundling phylacteries in it, bundled phylacteries in it, it is forbidden to bundle coins in it, he designated it but did not bundle in it, he bundled in it but did not designate it it is permitted to bundle coins in it.
llm_translation: "Why did they give it to me and wrap it up? Like Rav Ḥisdah, for Rav Ḥisdah said: This arrangement that is designated for placing tefillin in it, and if it is tight for tefillin – it is forbidden to place tefillin in it, it is obvious. If it is designated but not tight, or if it is tight but not designated – it is permitted to place tefillin in it, it is obvious."

hebrew_text: ולְאַבָּיֵי דְּאָמַר: הַזְמָנָה מִילְּתָא הִיא, אַזְמְנֵיהּ – אַף עַל גַּב דְּלָא צַר בֵּיהּ. צַר בֵּיהּ: אִי אַזְמְנֵיהּ – אִין, אִי לָא אַזְמְנֵיהּ – לָא.
human_translation: And according to Abaye, who said designation is matter, he designated even if he did not bundle in it, he bundled in it, if he designated yes, if he did not designate it not
llm_translation: To Abbaye who said: The appointment is a matter, its appointments - even though it is not necessary in it. Necessary in it: if its appointments - yes, if not its appointments - no.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: נֶפֶשׁ שֶׁבְּנָאוֹ לְשֵׁם חַי – מוּתָּר בַּהֲנָאָה. הוֹסִיף בּוֹ דִּימוֹס אֶחָד לְשֵׁם מֵת – אָסוּר בַּהֲנָאָה. הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן? דִּרְמָא בֵּיהּ מֵת.
human_translation: Come hear a monument for the sake of alive, permitted to benefit row was added to it for the sake of a corpse, prohibited from benefit With what are we dealing here? where the corpse was placed
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Come and hear: A soul that is designated for the name of the living - permitted for benefit. If one added to it one additional name for the name of the deceased - prohibited for benefit. What are we dealing with here? A fetus in which a deceased is involved.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, מַאי אִירְיָא הוֹסִיף? כִּי לֹא הוֹסִיף נָמֵי! לָא צְרִיכָא, אַף עַל גַּב דְּפַנְּיֵיהּ.
human_translation: If so, why specifically was added? even when was not added, No, necessary even if was removed
llm_translation: If so, what is the meaning of "added"? For he did not actually add! It is not necessary, even though he turned his face away.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַפְרָם בַּר פָּפָּא אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: אִם הָיָה מַכִּירוֹ, חוֹלְצוֹ וּמוּתָּר.
human_translation: Rafram bar Pappa says Rav Ḥisda says: If one recognizes remove and permitted
llm_translation: Rafhram son of Papa said, Rav Hisda said: If he recognizes him, he may remove it and it is permitted.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: הַחוֹצֵב קֶבֶר לְאָבִיו, וְהָלַךְ וּקְבָרוֹ בְּקֶבֶר אַחֵר – הֲרֵי זֶה לֹא יִקָּבֵר בּוֹ עוֹלָמִית. הָתָם, מִשּׁוּם כְּבוֹד אָבִיו.
human_translation: Come hear one hewed a grave for his father and went and buried him in a different place, may never be buried in There, because the honor his father,
llm_translation: Come and hear: One who digs a grave for his father, and then goes and buries him in another grave - behold, this one shall not be buried in it eternally. There, it is prohibited on account of the honor of his father.

hebrew_text: הָכִי נָמֵי מִסְתַּבְּרָא, דְּקָתָנֵי סֵיפָא: רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר, אַף הַחוֹצֵב אֲבָנִים לְאָבִיו וְהָלַךְ וּקְבָרוֹ בְּמָקוֹם אַחֵר – הֲרֵי זֶה לֹא יִקָּבֵר בָּהֶן עוֹלָמִית.
human_translation: So, too, it is reasonable as the latter clause teaches: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Even one hewed stones for his father’s and went and buried him in a different place, may never be buried from those
llm_translation: So it was explained, as it is taught in the latter part: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says, even one who hews stones for his father and then goes and buries him in another place - this one shall not be buried with them eternally.

hebrew_text: אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא מִשּׁוּם כְּבוֹד אָבִיו – שַׁפִּיר, אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ מִשּׁוּם הַזְמָנָה: טְוִוי לַאֲרִיגָה מִי אִיכָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר?
human_translation: Granted, if you say because of the honor his father, well But if you say because of designation, is there anyone who says spinning to weave
llm_translation: If you say it is due to honoring his father - it is fine. But if you say it is due to an appointment: "Is there a weaving implement for anyone who says?"

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: קֶבֶר חָדָשׁ מוּתָּר בַּהֲנָאָה. הֵטִיל בּוֹ נֵפֶל – אָסוּר בַּהֲנָאָה. הֵטִיל – אִין, לֹא הֵטִיל – לָא.
human_translation: Come hear a fresh grave permitted to benefit a non-viable newborn was cast into it, prohibited from benefit was cast yes, was not cast not
llm_translation: Come and hear: A new grave is permitted for benefit. If one threw a corpse into it - it is prohibited for benefit. If he threw - no, if he did not throw - no.

hebrew_text: הוּא הַדִּין דְּאַף עַל גַּב דְּלָא הֵטִיל, וּלְאַפּוֹקֵי מִדְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל דְּאָמַר: אֵין לִנְפָלִים תְּפִיסַת הַקֶּבֶר, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: The same is true even if was not cast to exclude of Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, who says: A non-viable newborn does not take possession of its grave teaches us
llm_translation: The same is the law even though he did not cast, and to oppose the opinion of Rabbi Shimon ben Gamliel who said: "The fallen have no claim to the grave," it is heard for us.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: מוֹתַר הַמֵּתִים – לְמֵתִים, מוֹתַר הַמֵּת – לְיוֹרְשָׁיו. הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן? שֶׁגָּבוּ מֵחַיִּים.
human_translation: Come hear left over the dead to dead left over dead person to his heirs. With what are we dealing here? that had been collected during his lifetime.
llm_translation: Come and hear: Permitted to the dead - for the dead, permitted the dead - for his heirs. What are we dealing with here? That which was collected from the living.

hebrew_text: הָא לָא תָּנֵי הָכִי, דִּתְנַן: מוֹתַר הַמֵּתִים – לְמֵתִים, מוֹתַר הַמֵּת – לְיוֹרְשָׁיו. וְתָנֵי עֲלַהּ: כֵּיצַד? גָּבוּ לְמֵתִים סְתָם – זֶהוּ מוֹתַר הַמֵּתִים לְמֵתִים, גָּבוּ לְמֵת זֶה – זֶהוּ מוֹתַר הַמֵּת לְיוֹרְשָׁיו.
human_translation: But we were not taught this, as we learned left over the dead to dead left over dead to his heirs. And it is taught with regard to this How so? they collected for the dead without specification, this is left over the dead to dead they collected for this dead this is left over dead to his heirs.
llm_translation: Here is the English translation of the Talmudic text: It was not taught thusly: as we learned: property of the deceased - for the deceased, property of the deceased - for his heirs. And it was taught about it: how so? If he gave to the deceased in general - this is property of the deceased for the deceased, if he gave to a specific deceased person - this is property of the deceased for his heirs.

hebrew_text: וְלִיטַעְמָיךְ, אֵימָא סֵיפָא: רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר, לֹא יִגַּע בָּהֶן עַד שֶׁיָּבֹא אֵלִיָּהוּ. רַבִּי נָתָן אוֹמֵר: יַעֲשֶׂנּוּ דִּימוֹס עַל קִבְרוֹ אוֹ זִילּוּף לִפְנֵי מִטָּתוֹ.
human_translation: And according to your reasoning, say the latter clause Rabbi Meir says: may not be touched until Elijah comes Rabbi Natan says: used row over the grave of or sprinkling before his bier
llm_translation: And to taste, say the latter: Rabbi Meir says, he shall not touch them until Elijah comes. Rabbi Nathan says: Let him make a dyemus on his grave or a ziluf before his bed.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, אַבָּיֵי מְתָרֵץ לְטַעְמֵיהּ וְרָבָא מְתָרֵץ לְטַעְמֵיהּ. אַבָּיֵי מְתָרֵץ לְטַעְמֵיהּ: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא הַזְמָנָה מִילְּתָא הִיא. תַּנָּא קַמָּא סָבַר: דַּחֲזֵי לֵיהּ – תָּפֵיס, דְּלָא חֲזֵי לֵיהּ – לָא תָּפֵיס.
human_translation: Rather, Abaye explain according to his reasoning, and Rava, explain according to his reasoning. Abaye explain according to his reasoning, According to everyone, designation is matter. first tanna holds that is fitting to is encompassed that is not fitting to is not encompassed
llm_translation: Rather, Abbaye interprets according to his reasoning and Rava interprets according to his reasoning. Abbaye interprets according to his reasoning: because the entire world is considered as if it were a matter of invitation. The first Tanna holds: if he sees it, he may take it; if he does not see it, he may not take it.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי מֵאִיר מְסַפְּקָא לֵיהּ, אִי תָּפֵיס אִי לָא תָּפֵיס. הִלְכָּךְ, לֹא יִגַּע בָּהֶן עַד שֶׁיָּבֹא אֵלִיָּהוּ. וְרַבִּי נָתָן פְּשִׁיטָא לֵיהּ דְּוַדַּאי תָּפֵיס, הִלְכָּךְ יֵעָשֶׂה דִּימוֹס עַל קִבְרוֹ.
human_translation: And Rabbi Meir is uncertain whether is encompassed or is not encompassed Therefore, may not be touched until Elijah comes And obvious to Rabbi Natan that is certainly encompassed Therefore, used row over the grave of
llm_translation: Rabbi Meir is in doubt about it, whether it will catch or not catch. Therefore, one should not touch them until Elijah comes. And Rabbi Natan is certain about it, that it will definitely catch, therefore let him make a plaster on his grave.

hebrew_text: וְרָבָא מְתָרֵץ לְטַעְמֵיהּ: לְכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא הַזְמָנָה לָאו מִילְּתָא הִיא. תַּנָּא קַמָּא סָבַר: כִּי בָּזוּ לֵיהּ, אַחוֹלֵי מַחֵיל זִילוּתֵיהּ גַּבֵּי יוֹרְשִׁין.
human_translation: And Rava, explain according to his reasoning, According to everyone, designation is nothing, first tanna holds disgraced him forgoes his disgrace for heirs,
llm_translation: Rava resolves according to his reasoning: To everyone in the world, an invitation is not a matter. The first Tanna thought: When they despise him, his heirs will inherit his possessions.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי מֵאִיר מְסַפְּקָא לֵיהּ אִי מַחֵיל אִי לָא מַחֵיל, הִלְכָּךְ לֹא יִגַּע בָּהֶן כּוּ׳. וְרַבִּי נָתָן פְּשִׁיטָא לֵיהּ דְּלָא מַחֵיל, הִלְכָּךְ יֵעָשֶׂה דִּימוֹס עַל קִבְרוֹ אוֹ זִילּוּף לִפְנֵי מִטָּתוֹ.
human_translation: And Rabbi Meir is uncertain whether forgoes or does not forgo Therefore, may not be touched And obvious to Rabbi Natan that does not forgo Therefore, used row over the grave of or sprinkling before his bier.
llm_translation: Rabbi Meir is in doubt whether he permits or does not permit, therefore he should not touch them. And Rabbi Natan clearly holds that he does not permit, therefore a likeness should be made on his grave or a plastering before his bed.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: הָיוּ אָבִיו וְאִמּוֹ מְזָרְקִין בּוֹ כֵּלִים, מִצְוָה עַל הָאֲחֵרִים לְהַצִּילָן.
human_translation: Come hear If the father and the mother of were throwing garments onto a mitzva for the others to save
llm_translation: Come and hear: If his father and mother were throwing utensils at him, it is a mitzvah for others to save them.

hebrew_text: הָתָם מִשּׁוּם מְרָרַיְיהוּ. אִי הָכִי, הַיְינוּ דְּקָתָנֵי עֲלַהּ: אָמַר רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים? שֶׁלֹּא נָגְעוּ בַּמִּטָּה, אֲבָל נָגְעוּ בַּמִּטָּה – אֲסוּרִין.
human_translation: There, because of their bitterness If so, that which is taught with regard to Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said: In what is this statement said? where did not touch the bier But they touched the bier, they are forbidden.
llm_translation: There, because of their bitterness. If so, that is what it teaches about the leaf: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said: In what case are these words spoken? When they did not touch the bed, but if they touched the bed - they are forbidden.

hebrew_text: תַּרְגְּמַהּ עוּלָּא: בְּמִטָּה הַנִּקְבֶּרֶת עִמּוֹ, דְּמִחַלְּפִי בְּתַכְרִיכִי הַמֵּת.
human_translation: Ulla interpreted onto a bier that was to be buried with that be mistaken for shrouds of the deceased.
llm_translation: Translate: Ula interpreted: "In the bed where the deceased is buried with him, for he exchanged with the burial shrouds of the deceased."

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: כִּיס שֶׁעֲשָׂאוֹ לְהַנִּיחַ בּוֹ תְּפִילִּין – אָסוּר לְהַנִּיחַ בּוֹ מָעוֹת. הִנִּיחַ בּוֹ תְּפִילִּין – יַנִּיחַ בּוֹ מָעוֹת. אֵימָא: עֲשָׂאוֹ וְהִנִּיחַ בּוֹ תְּפִילִּין – אָסוּר לְהַנִּיחַ בּוֹ מָעוֹת, כִּדְרַב חִסְדָּא.
human_translation: Come hear one fashioned a pouch in which to put phylacteries, it is prohibited to put money in it. he put phylacteries in it, he may put money in it. Say one fashioned and put the phylacteries in it, it is prohibited to put money in it. in accordance with of Rav Ḥisda,
llm_translation: Come and hear: A purse that one made to place tefillin in it - it is forbidden to place coins in it. If one placed tefillin in it - he may place coins in it. Perhaps: if one made it and placed tefillin in it - it is forbidden to place coins in it, as Rav Ḥisda said.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: אָמַר לְאוּמָּן ״עֲשֵׂה לִי תִּיק שֶׁל סֵפֶר״ אוֹ ״נַרְתִּיק שֶׁל תְּפִילִּין״ – עַד שֶׁלֹּא נִשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ בָּהֶן קוֹדֶשׁ, מוּתָּר לְהִשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ בָּהֶן חוֹל. נִשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ בָּהֶן קוֹדֶשׁ – אָסוּר לְהִשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ בָּהֶן חוֹל.
human_translation: Come hear one said to a craftsman: Fashion me a case [ tik ] for scroll, or: a bag [ nartik ] for phylacteries, as long as he has not used them a sacred permitted to use them a mundane he used them a sacred prohibited to use them a mundane
llm_translation: Come and hear: A craftsman said, "Make for me a pouch of a book" or "a pouch of phylacteries" - until he has not used them for holy purposes, it is permitted to use them for secular purposes. If he used them for holy purposes - it is forbidden to use them for secular purposes.

hebrew_text: תַּנָּאֵי הִיא, דְּתַנְיָא: צִיפָּן זָהָב אוֹ שֶׁטָּלָה עֲלֵיהֶן עוֹר שֶׁל בְּהֵמָה טְמֵאָה – פְּסוּלוֹת. עוֹר בְּהֵמָה טְהוֹרָה – כְּשֵׁירוֹת, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁלֹּא עִיבְּדָן לִשְׁמָן. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: אַף עוֹר בְּהֵמָה טְהוֹרָה פְּסוּלוֹת, עַד שֶׁיְּעַבְּדוֹ לִשְׁמָן.
human_translation: is tanna’im . As it is taught coated them with gold or patched them hide of a non-kosher animal, they are unfit. hide of a kosher animal they are fit, and even though he did not prepare them, for their sake, Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Even hide of a kosher animal they are unfit, until he prepares them for their sake.
llm_translation: It is taught in a Baraita: If gold was plated or if the skin of an impure animal was spread over them - they are disqualified. The skin of a pure animal - they are valid, even though they were not tanned for their oil. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Even the skin of a pure animal is disqualified until it is tanned for its oil.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבִינָא לְרָבָא: מִי אִיכָּא דּוּכְתָּא דְּרָמוּ בֵּיהּ מֵת, וְאָרְגִי בֶּגֶד לַמֵּת? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִין, כְּגוֹן שָׁכְבֵי דְּהַרְפַּנְיָא.
human_translation: Ravina said to Rava: Is there a place where the deceased is placed and weave a garment for the deceased? said to Yes, for example, the dead of Harpanya,
llm_translation: Ravina said to Rava: Is there anyone who wraps the deceased in a shroud and then sews a garment for the deceased? He said to him: No, for example, the people of Harpanya.

hebrew_text: דְּרַשׁ מָרִימָר: הִלְכְתָא כְּוָותֵיהּ דְּאַבָּיֵי, וְרַבָּנַן אָמְרִי: הִלְכְתָא כְּוָותֵיהּ דְּרָבָא. וְהִלְכְתָא כְּוָותֵיהּ דְּרָבָא.
human_translation: Mareimar taught halakha in accordance with of Abaye And the Rabbis say halakha is in accordance with of Rava halakha in accordance with of Rava
llm_translation: Marimar expounded: The halakha follows the opinion of Abbaye, while the Rabbis say: The halakha follows the opinion of Rava. And the halakha follows the opinion of Rava.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הֲרוּגֵי מַלְכוּת – נִכְסֵיהֶן לַמֶּלֶךְ, הֲרוּגֵי בֵּית דִּין – נִכְסֵיהֶן לַיּוֹרְשִׁין. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אַף הֲרוּגֵי מַלְכוּת נִכְסֵיהֶן לַיּוֹרְשִׁין. אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה: וַהֲלֹא כְּבָר נֶאֱמַר ״הִנֵּה בְּכֶרֶם נָבוֹת אֲשֶׁר יָרַד שָׁם לְרִשְׁתּוֹ״?
human_translation: The Sages taught those executed by king their property to the king. those executed by the court their property to heirs. Rabbi Yehuda says: Even those executed by king, their property to heirs. said to Rabbi Yehuda: But isn’t already stated: behold he is in the vineyard of Naboth, where he is gone down there to inherit it”
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: Those executed by the monarchy - their possessions go to the king; those executed by the court - their possessions go to their heirs. Rabbi Yehuda says: Even the possessions of those executed by the monarchy go to their heirs. They said to Rabbi Yehuda: But hasn't it already been stated, "Behold, in the vineyard of Naboth, where he has gone down to inherit it"?

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָהֶן: בֶּן אֲחִי אָבִיו הָיָה, וְרָאוּי לְיוֹרְשׁוֹ הָיָה. וַהֲלֹא הַרְבֵּה בָּנִים הָיוּ לוֹ? אָמַר לָהֶן: אוֹתוֹ וְאֶת בָּנָיו הָרַג, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אִם לֹא אֶת דְּמֵי נָבוֹת וְאֶת דְּמֵי בָנָיו רָאִיתִי״. וְרַבָּנַן? הַהוּא בָּנִים הָרְאוּיִין לָצֵאת מִמֶּנּוּ.
