human_translation: said to them: was the son of his paternal uncle, and he was fit to inherit him. But Naboth had many sons. said to them: executed and his sons, as it is stated: “I have seen the blood of Naboth and the blood of his sons” And the Rabbis that the sons who would have issued from him
llm_translation: He said to them: "He was the son of his father's brother, and he was fit to inherit. But didn't he have many sons?" He said to them: "He and his sons were killed, as it is stated: 'If I have not seen the blood of Naboth and the blood of his sons.' And the Rabbis? Those sons were fit to emerge from him."

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר נִכְסֵיהֶן לַמֶּלֶךְ, הַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב ״בֵּרַךְ נָבוֹת אֱלֹהִים וָמֶלֶךְ״. אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר נִכְסֵיהֶן לַיּוֹרְשִׁין, לְמָה לִי ״וָמֶלֶךְ״?
human_translation: Granted, according to the one who says the property of to the king, that is that it is written “Naboth cursed God and the king” But according to the one who says the property of to heirs, why do I king?
llm_translation: In truth, according to the one who says their property belongs to the king, that is what is written, "Bless the offspring of God and the king." But according to the one who says their property belongs to the heirs, why do I need "and the king"?

hebrew_text: וּלְטַעְמָיךְ, אֱלֹהִים לְמָה לִי? אֶלָּא לְאַפּוֹשֵׁי רִיתְחָא. הָכִי נָמֵי, לְאַפּוֹשֵׁי רִיתְחָא.
human_translation: And according to your reasoning, why do I God? Rather, to increase the anger So too, to increase the anger
llm_translation: And according to your reasoning, "Why do I need God?" Rather, to test the fear of Heaven. Thus it is stated, "to test the fear of Heaven."

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר: ״נִכְסֵיהֶן לַמֶּלֶךְ״, הַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיָּנׇס יוֹאָב אֶל אֹהֶל ה׳ וַיַּחֲזֵק בְּקַרְנוֹת הַמִּזְבֵּחַ״, וּכְתִיב: ״וַיֹּאמֶר לֹא אֵצֵא כִּי פֹּה אָמוּת״. אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר: ״נִכְסֵיהֶן לַיּוֹרְשִׁין״, מַאי נָפְקָא לֵיהּ מִינַּהּ? לְחַיֵּי שָׁעָה.
human_translation: Granted, according to the one who says the property of to the king, that is that it is written: “And Joab fled to the tent of the Lord and caught hold of the horns of the altar” and it is written: “And he said, I will not leave, for here I will die” But according to the one who says the property of to heirs, what difference to him? to live a short while
llm_translation: In truth, according to the one who says, "Their property belongs to the king," that is as it is written: "And Joab fled to the tent of the Lord and took hold of the horns of the altar," and it is written: "And he said, 'I will not go out, for here I will die.'" But according to the one who says, "Their property belongs to the heirs," what practical difference does it make to him? It is a temporary measure.

hebrew_text: ״וַיָּשֶׁב בְּנָיָהוּ אֶת הַמֶּלֶךְ דָּבָר לֵאמֹר כֹּה דִבֶּר יוֹאָב וְכֹה עָנָנִי״. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: זִיל אֵימָא לֵיהּ: תַּרְתֵּי לָא תַּעֲבֵיד בְּהַאי גַּבְרָא. אִי קָטְלַתְּ לֵיהּ, קַבֵּול לָטוּתֵיהּ דְּלַטְיֵיהּ אֲבוּךְ. וְאִי לָא, שִׁבְקֵיהּ דְּלֵיקוּ בְּלָטוּתֵיהּ דְּלַטְיֵיהּ אֲבוּךְ. ״וַיֹּאמֶר לוֹ הַמֶּלֶךְ עֲשֵׂה כַּאֲשֶׁר דִּבֶּר וּפְגַע בּוֹ וּקְבַרְתּוֹ״.
human_translation: “And Benaiah brought the king word back, saying: So said Joab, and so he answered me” said to him: Go and say to You cannot perform two to this man, If you kill him, you will receive the curses with which your father cursed me. And if not let him go so that he may receive the curses with which your father cursed him. “And the king said to him: Do as he has said, and fall upon him, and bury him.”
llm_translation: "And Benaiah returned the king's word, saying, 'Thus spoke Joab, and thus he answered me.' He said to him: 'Go, say to him: You shall not do two things with this man. If you kill him, accept the consequences that your father's house will be destroyed. And if not, leave him, for they will burn with the consequences that your father's house will be destroyed.' And the king said to him, 'Do as he spoke, and strike him and bury him.'"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: כׇּל קְלָלוֹת שֶׁקִּילֵּל דָּוִד אֶת יוֹאָב נִתְקַיְּימוּ בְּזַרְעוֹ שֶׁל דָּוִד. ״אַל יִכָּרֵת מִבֵּית יוֹאָב זָב וּמְצֹרָע וּמַחֲזִיק בַּפֶּלֶךְ וְנֹפֵל בַּחֶרֶב וַחֲסַר לָחֶם״.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Rav says: All the curses with which David cursed Joab were fulfilled in David’s descendants, “Let the house of Joab never lack such as are afflicted with a discharge, or a leper, or that hold onto a staff, or fall by the sword, or lack bread”
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: All the curses that David cursed Joab were fulfilled in the seed of David. "Let there not fail from the house of Joab one that hath an issue, or that is a leper, or that leaneth on a staff, or that falleth on the sword, or that lacketh bread."

hebrew_text: ״זָב״ – מֵרְחַבְעָם, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְהַמֶּלֶךְ רְחַבְעָם הִתְאַמֵּץ לַעֲלוֹת בַּמֶּרְכָּבָה לָנוּס יְרוּשָׁלִָים״, וּכְתִיב: ״וְכׇל הַמֶּרְכָּב אֲשֶׁר יִרְכַּב עָלָיו הַזָּב יִטְמָא״.
human_translation: “with a discharge,” in Rehoboam, as it is written: “And King Rehoboam made speed to get him up to his chariot [ bamerkava ] to flee to Jerusalem” and it is written: “And whatever saddle [ hamerkav ] he that has a discharge rides upon shall be unclean”
llm_translation: "Zav" - from Rehoboam, as it is written: "And King Rehoboam strengthened himself to go up in the chariot to flee to Jerusalem," and it is written: "And all the chariot upon which the Zav will ride, it shall be unclean."

hebrew_text: ״מְצוֹרָע״ – מֵעוּזִּיָּהוּ, דִּכְתִיב: ״וּבְחֶזְקָתוֹ גָּבַהּ לִבּוֹ עַד לְהַשְׁחִית וַיִּמְעַל בַּה׳ אֱלֹהָיו וַיָּבֹא אֶל הֵיכַל ה׳ לְהַקְטִיר עַל מִזְבַּח הַקְּטֹרֶת״, וּכְתִיב: ״וְהַצָּרַעַת זָרְחָה בְמִצְחוֹ״.
human_translation: “a leper” in Uzziah, as it is written: “But when he was strong, his heart was lifted up to his destruction; for he transgressed against the Lord his God, and went into the Temple of the Lord to burn incense upon the altar of incense” And it is written: “And leprosy broke out on his forehead”
llm_translation: "Tzara'at" - Me'uziyahu, as it is written: "And in his presumption he acted corruptly and trespassed against the Lord his God, and entered into the temple of the Lord to burn incense upon the altar of incense," and it is written: "And the tzara'at appeared on his forehead."

hebrew_text: ״מַחֲזִיק בְּפֶלֶךְ״ – מֵאָסָא, דִּכְתִיב: ״רַק לְעֵת זִקְנָתוֹ חָלָה אֶת רַגְלָיו.״ וְאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: שֶׁאֲחָזוֹ פּוֹדַגְרָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ מָר זוּטְרָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן לְרַב נַחְמָן: הֵיכִי דָּמֵי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: כְּמַחַט בִּבְשַׂר הַחַי. מְנָא יָדַע? אִי בָּעֵית אֵימָא: מֵיחַשׁ הֲוָה חָיֵישׁ בֵּיהּ. וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: מֵרַבֵּיהּ הֲוָה גְּמִיר לַהּ. וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: ״סוֹד ה׳ לִירֵאָיו וּבְרִיתוֹ לְהוֹדִיעָם״.
human_translation: “hold onto a staff” in Asa, as it is written “But in the time of his old age, he was diseased in his feet” And Rav Yehuda says Rav says: that he was seized with gout [ podagra ]. Mar Zutra, son of Rav Naḥman, said to Rav Naḥman: What are the circumstances said to him: similar to a needle live flesh. How did know If you wish, say suffered from And if you wish, say he learned it from his teacher. And if you wish, say “The secret of the Lord is with them that fear Him; and He will show to them His covenant”
llm_translation: "Maḥazik be-felekh" - Me'asa, dikhtiv: "Rak le'et ziknato ḥalah et raglav." Ve'amar Rav Yehudah amar Rav: she'achazo podag'ra. Amar lei Mar Zutra bereih de-Rav Naḥman le-Rav Naḥman: heichi damei? Amar lei: ke-maḥat bivsar ha-ḥai. Menah yada? Iy ba'ita eima: meiḥash hava ḥayesh beih. Ve-ibaita eima: me-rabbeih hava gemir la. Ve-ibaita eima: "Sod Hashem li-re'avav u-berito lehodi'am."

hebrew_text: ״נוֹפֵל בַּחֶרֶב״ – מִיֹּאשִׁיָּהוּ, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיֹּרוּ הַמּוֹרִים לַמֶּלֶךְ יֹאשִׁיָּהוּ״. וְאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: שֶׁעָשׂוּ כׇּל גּוּפוֹ כִּכְבָרָה.
human_translation: “fall by the sword” in Josiah, as it is written: “And the archers shot at King Josiah” and Rav Yehuda says Rav says: that they turned his whole body into a sieve.
llm_translation: "Fallen by the sword" - referring to King Josiah, as it is written: "And the archers shot at King Josiah." And Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: They made his entire body like a sieve.

hebrew_text: ״וַחֲסַר לֶחֶם״ – מִיכׇנְיָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַאֲרֻחָתוֹ אֲרֻחַת תָּמִיד נִתְּנָה לוֹ״. אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: הַיְינוּ דְּאָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי:
human_translation: “lack bread” in Jeconiah, as it is written “And as for his food allowance, there was a continual food allowance given him by the king, Rav Yehuda says Rav says: This that people say:
llm_translation: "And lacking bread" - Michnayeh, as it is written: "And his allowance was a continual allowance given him." Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: This is what people say:

hebrew_text: תְּהֵא לוּטָא, וְלָא תְּהֵא לָאטָא.
human_translation: Be the one who is cursed and not the one who curses,
llm_translation: Let it be a Lotah, and not a Atah.

hebrew_text: אַתְיוּהּ לְיוֹאָב, דַּיְּינֵיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַאי טַעְמָא קְטַלְתֵּיהּ לְאַבְנֵר? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: גּוֹאֵל הַדָּם דַּעֲשָׂאֵל הֲוַאי. עֲשָׂאֵל רוֹדֵף הֲוָה. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָיָה לוֹ לְהַצִּילוֹ בְּאֶחָד מֵאֵבָרָיו.
human_translation: They brought Joab judged him. said to What is the reason you killed Abner? said to him: I was the blood redeemer of Asahel; Asahel was a pursuer. said to could have saved himself by one of his limbs.
llm_translation: He came to Yoav, his judge. He said to him: "Why did you kill Avner?" He said to him: "The blood avenger was upon him. He was a pursuer." He said to him: "He should have saved him with one of his limbs."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא יְכֵיל לֵיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הַשְׁתָּא בְּדוֹפֶן חֲמִישִׁית כַּיוֵּן לֵיהּ, דִּכְתִיב ״וַיַּכֵּהוּ אַבְנֵר בְּאַחֲרֵי הַחֲנִית אֶל הַחֹמֶשׁ״, וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: בְּדוֹפֶן חֲמִישִׁית, בְּמָקוֹם שֶׁמָּרָה וְכָבֵד תְּלוּיִין בּוֹ. בְּאֶחָד מֵאֵבָרָיו לָא יְכֵיל לֵיהּ?
human_translation: said to him: not able to said to Now aim him in the fifth rib, as it is written: “And Abner smote him with the butt end of the spear in the ḥomesh ” and Rabbi Yoḥanan says in the fifth rib, the place where the gallbladder and liver hang. could he not have at one of limbs?
llm_translation: He said to him: it is not able for him. He said to him: this is with a fifth in the handle, as it is written "And Avner struck him with the back of the spear in the abdomen," and Rabbi Yochanan said: with a fifth in the handle, in a place where it is smooth and heavy are dependent on it. In one of his limbs is it not able for him?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: נֵיזִיל אַבְנֵר, מַאי טַעְמָא קְטַלְתֵּיהּ לַעֲמָשָׂא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: עֲמָשָׂא מוֹרֵד בַּמַּלְכוּת הֲוָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיֹּאמֶר הַמֶּלֶךְ לַעֲמָשָׂא הַזְעֶק לִי אֶת אִישׁ יְהוּדָה שְׁלֹשֶׁת יָמִים וְגוֹ׳ וַיֵּלֶךְ עֲמָשָׂא לְהַזְעִיק אֶת יְהוּדָה וַיּוֹחֶר וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: said to Set aside Abner, what is the reason you killed Amasa? said to him: Amasa rebelled against the king, as it is written: “And the king said to Amasa: Muster to me the men of Judah within three days, And Amasa went to call the men of Judah, but he was later
llm_translation: He said to him: Let's go to Avner, why did you kill him to Amasa? He said to him: Amasa was rebelling against the kingdom, as it is written: "And the king said to Amasa, 'Call me the men of Judah for three days, etc.' And Amasa went to call Judah and he delayed, etc."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: עֲמָשָׂא ״אַכִּין״ וְ״רַקִּין״ דְּרַשׁ.
human_translation: said to him: Amasa interpreted akh and rak
llm_translation: He said to him: Amasa "prepared" and "softened" he sought.

hebrew_text: אַשְׁכְּחִינְהוּ דִּפְתִיחַ לְהוּ בְּמַסֶּכְתָּא. אֲמַר: כְּתִיב ״כׇּל אִישׁ אֲשֶׁר יַמְרֶה אֶת פִּיךָ וְלֹא יִשְׁמַע אֶת דְּבָרֶיךָ לְכֹל אֲשֶׁר תְּצַוֶּנּוּ יוּמָת״. יָכוֹל אֲפִילּוּ לְדִבְרֵי תוֹרָה? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״רַק חֲזַק וֶאֱמָץ״.
human_translation: found starting to tractate. He said It is written: “Any man who rebels against your commandment, and will not listen to your words in all that you command him, he shall be put to death” might even to the words of Torah. verse states: “Only [ rak ] be strong and of a good courage.”
llm_translation: I found them that they opened to him in the tractate. He said: It is written, "Every man who rebels against your command and does not listen to your words in all that you command him shall be put to death." Could this even apply to matters of Torah? The Talmud teaches: "Only be strong and courageous."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, הָהוּא גַּבְרָא מוֹרֵד בַּמַּלְכוּת הֲוָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְהַשְּׁמֻעָה בָּאָה עַד יוֹאָב כִּי יוֹאָב נָטָה אַחֲרֵי אֲדֹנִיָּה וְאַחֲרֵי אַבְשָׁלוֹם לֹא נָטָה״.
human_translation: Rather, That man, rebelled against the king, as it is written: “Then tidings came to Joab, for Joab had followed after Adonijah, though he had not followed after Absalom.
llm_translation: Rather, that man was a rebel against the kingdom, as it is written: "And the news came to Joab, for Joab had turned after Adonijah, though he had not turned after Absalom."

hebrew_text: מַאי ״לֹא נָטָה״? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: שֶׁבִּיקֵּשׁ לִנְטוֹת וְלֹא נָטָה. וּמַאי טַעְמָא לָא נָטָה? אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: עֲדַיִין לִיחְלוּחִית שֶׁל דָּוִד קַיֶּימֶת.
human_translation: What did not follow Rav Yehuda says: that wanted to follow but he did not follow what is the reason did not follow Rabbi Elazar says: David was still in vitality,
llm_translation: What is "did not incline"? Rav Yehudah said: he sought to incline but did not incline. And why did he not incline? Rabbi Elazar said: the anointing oil of David still remained.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא אָמַר: עֲדַיִין אִיצְטַגְנִינֵי שֶׁל דָּוִד קַיָּימִין, דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: אַרְבַּע מֵאוֹת יְלָדִים הָיוּ לוֹ לְדָוִד, כּוּלָּן בְּנֵי יְפַת תּוֹאַר הָיוּ, וּמְגַדְּלֵי בְלוֹרִית הָיוּ, וּמְהַלְּכִין בְּרָאשֵׁי הַגְּיָיסוֹת הָיוּ, וְהֵן הֵן בַּעֲלֵי אֶגְרוֹפִין שֶׁל דָּוִד.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, says: David’s stars [ itztagninei ], still stood As Rav Yehuda says Rav says: David had four hundred children all of them were sons of beautiful women and they grew a gentile hair style, and they would go at the head of the troops, and they were the strong-arm of David,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Chanina, said: The shields of David are still in existence, as Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: David had four hundred children, all of them were of beautiful appearance, and they were brought up in silk, and they walked at the head of the regiments, and they are the same as the members of David's court.

hebrew_text: וּפְלִיגָא דְּרַבִּי אַבָּא בַּר כָּהֲנָא, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא בַּר כָּהֲנָא: אִילְמָלֵא דָּוִד לֹא עָשָׂה יוֹאָב מִלְחָמָה, וְאִילְמָלֵא יוֹאָב לֹא עָסַק דָּוִד בַּתּוֹרָה. דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיְהִי דָוִד עֹשֶׂה מִשְׁפָּט וּצְדָקָה לְכׇל עַמּוֹ וְיוֹאָב בֶּן צְרוּיָה עַל הַצָּבָא״. מָה טַעַם ״דָוִד עֹשֶׂה מִשְׁפָּט וּצְדָקָה לְכׇל עַמּוֹ״? מִשּׁוּם דְּ״יוֹאָב עַל הַצָּבָא״. וּמָה טַעַם ״יוֹאָב עַל הַצָּבָא״? מִשּׁוּם דְּ״דָוִד עֹשֶׂה מִשְׁפָּט וּצְדָקָה לְכׇל עַמּוֹ״.
human_translation: And disagree of Rabbi Abba bar Kahana, as Rabbi Abba bar Kahana says: Were it not for David, Joab would not have wage war and were it not for Joab, David would not have study Torah. As it is written: “And David executed judgment and justice to all his people, and Joab, son of Zeruiah, was over the army” What is the reason David “executed judgment and justice to all his people”? because “Joab, was over the army,” And what is the reason “Joab, was over the army”? because “David executed judgment and justice to all his people.”
llm_translation: The dispute of Rabbi Abba bar Kahana, as Rabbi Abba bar Kahana said: If not for David, Joab would not have engaged in war, and if not for Joab, David would not have studied Torah. As it is written: "And David administered justice and righteousness to all his people, and Joab the son of Zeruiah was over the army." What is the reason for "David administered justice and righteousness to all his people"? Because of "Joab was over the army." And what is the reason for "Joab was over the army"? Because of "David administered justice and righteousness to all his people."

hebrew_text: ״וַיֵּצֵא יוֹאָב מֵעִם דָּוִד וַיִּשְׁלַח מַלְאָכִים אַחֲרֵי אַבְנֵר וַיָּשִׁבוּ אֹתוֹ מִבּוֹר הַסִּרָה״. מַאי ״בּוֹר הַסִּירָה״? אָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא בַּר כָּהֲנָא: בּוֹר וְסִירָה גָּרְמוּ לוֹ לְאַבְנֵר שֶׁיֵּהָרֵג.
human_translation: “And Joab went out from David, and sent messengers after Abner, and they brought him back from Bor Sirah” What Bor Sirah? Rabbi Abba bar Kahana says: A well [ bor ] and a thorn [ vesira ] caused Abner to be killed.
llm_translation: "And Yoav went out from David and he sent messengers after Avner, and they brought him back from the well of Sirah." What is the "well of Sirah"? Rabbi Abba bar Kahana said: The well and the pot caused Avner to be killed.

hebrew_text: ״וַיַּטֵּהוּ יוֹאָב אֶל תּוֹךְ הַשַּׁעַר לְדַבֵּר אִתּוֹ בַּשֶּׁלִי״. אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: שֶׁדָּנוֹ דִּין סַנְהֶדְרִי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַאי טַעְמָא קְטַלְתֵּיהּ לַעֲשָׂאֵל? עֲשָׂאֵל רוֹדֵף הָיָה. הָיָה לְךָ לְהַצִּילוֹ בְּאֶחָד מֵאֵבָרָיו! לָא יְכֵילִי לֵיהּ. הַשְׁתָּא בְּדוֹפֶן חֲמִישִׁית כַּוֵּונְתְּ לֵיהּ, בְּאֶחָד מֵאֵבָרָיו לָא יְכֵלְתְּ לֵיהּ?
human_translation: “And Joab took him aside in the gate to speak with him quietly” Rabbi Yoḥanan says: judged the halakha of the Sanhedrin, said to What is the reason you killed Asahel? Asahel was a pursuer, you could have saved by one of his limbs. I was not able to Now you aim him in the fifth rib, could you not have at one of his limbs?
llm_translation: "And Joab leaned him against the gate to speak with him in peace." Rabbi Yochanan said: He judged him with the judgment of the Sanhedrin. He said to him: Why did you kill Asahel? Asahel was pursuing you. You could have saved him by striking one of his limbs! He could not. Now, with the fifth rib, did you intend to kill him? You could not have saved him by striking one of his limbs?

hebrew_text: ״לְדַבֵּר אִתּוֹ בַּשֶּׁלִי״, אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: עַל עִיסְקֵי שָׁלוּ. ״וַיַּכֵּהוּ שָׁם אֶל הַחֹמֶשׁ״, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: בְּדוֹפֶן חֲמִישִׁית, מָקוֹם שֶׁמָּרָה וְכָבֵד תְּלוּיִין בּוֹ.
human_translation: “to speak with him quietly [ basheli ]”? Rav Yehuda says Rav says: by way of deception [ shalu ]. “And smote him in the ḥomesh ” Rabbi Yoḥanan says: in the fifth [ ḥamishit ] rib, the place where the gallbladder and liver hang.
llm_translation: "To speak with him in private," said Rav Yehudah said Rav: regarding matters of peace. "And he struck him there to the fifth rib," said Rabbi Yochanan: with a fifth rib, a place where bitterness and heaviness are dependent on it.

hebrew_text: ״וְהֵשִׁיב ה׳ אֶת דָּמוֹ עַל רֹאשׁוֹ אֲשֶׁר פָּגַע בִּשְׁנֵי אֲנָשִׁים צַדִּקִים טוֹבִים מִמֶּנּוּ״. ״טוֹבִים״ – שֶׁהָיוּ דּוֹרְשִׁין ״אַכִּין״ וְ״רַקִּין״, וְהוּא לֹא דָּרַשׁ. ״צַדִּיקִים״ – שֶׁהֵן בַּפֶּה וְלֹא עָשׂוּ, וְהוּא בְּאִיגֶּרֶת עָשָׂה.
human_translation: “And the Lord shall return the blood upon his own head, for he fell upon two men more righteous better than he” “better” as they interpreted akh and rak while he did not interpret “more righteous” as they oral and they did not do whereas in a letter he did
llm_translation: "And Hashem returned his blood on his head, because he struck two righteous and good men." "Good" - that they were seeking "food" and "drink," and he did not provide. "Righteous" - that they were in the mouth but did not do, and he did through a letter.

hebrew_text: ״וַעֲמָשָׂא לֹא נִשְׁמַר בַּחֶרֶב אֲשֶׁר בְּיַד יוֹאָב״. אָמַר רַב: שֶׁלֹּא חֲשָׁדוֹ.
human_translation: “But Amasa took no heed of the sword in Joab’s hand” Rav says: because he did not suspect
llm_translation: "And Amasa was not careful with the sword that was in the hand of Joab." Rav said: They did not suspect him.

hebrew_text: ״וַיִּקָּבֵר בְּבֵיתוֹ בַּמִּדְבָּר״. אַטּוּ בֵּיתוֹ מִדְבָּר הוּא? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: כַּמִּדְבָּר, מָה מִדְבָּר מוּפְקָר לַכֹּל, אַף בֵּיתוֹ שֶׁל יוֹאָב מוּפְקָר לַכֹּל. דָּבָר אַחֵר: כַּמִּדְבָּר, מָה מִדְבָּר מְנוּקֶּה מִגָּזֵל וַעֲרָיוֹת, אַף בֵּיתוֹ שֶׁל יוֹאָב מְנוּקֶּה מִגָּזֵל וַעֲרָיוֹת. ״וְיוֹאָב יְחַיֶּה אֶת שְׁאָר הָעִיר״. אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: אֲפִילּוּ מוּנִינֵי וְצַחֲנָתָא טָעֵים פָּרֵיס לְהוּ.
human_translation: “And he was buried in his own house, in the wilderness” Is that to say house a wilderness? Rav Yehuda says Rav says: like the wilderness; just as the wilderness is open to all, so too, Joab’s house open to all, Alternatively, like the wilderness; just as the wilderness is clean of theft and sexual immorality, so too, Joab’s house was clean of theft and sexual immorality, “And Joab kept alive the rest of the city” Rav Yehuda says: he would even give them small fish
llm_translation: "And he was buried in his house in the wilderness." Is his house in the wilderness? Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: Like the wilderness, just as the wilderness is open to all, so too the house of Yoav is open to all. Another explanation: Like the wilderness, just as the wilderness is free from theft and immorality, so too the house of Yoav is free from theft and immorality. "And Yoav revived the rest of the city." Rav Yehudah said: Even the delicacies of Muninin and Tzachanata, he would spread out for them.

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ נִגְמַר הַדִּין
llm_translation: The judgment is concluded upon you.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אַרְבַּע מִיתוֹת נִמְסְרוּ לְבֵית דִּין: סְקִילָה, שְׂרֵיפָה, הֶרֶג, וָחֶנֶק. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: שְׂרֵיפָה, סְקִילָה, חֶנֶק, וָהֶרֶג. זוֹ מִצְוַת הַנִּסְקָלִין.
human_translation: Four types of death were given over to court, Stoning, burning, killing and strangulation. Rabbi Shimon says: Burning, stoning, strangulation, and killing. This the mitzva of those who are stoned,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: Four types of capital punishment are entrusted to the court: stoning, burning, killing, and strangulation. Rabbi Shimon says: Burning, stoning, strangulation, and killing. This is the commandment regarding those who are stoned.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רָבָא אָמַר רַב סְחוֹרָא אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁשָּׁנוּ חֲכָמִים דֶּרֶךְ מִנְיָין, אֵין מוּקְדָּם וּמְאוּחָר, חוּץ מִשִּׁבְעָה סַמָּנִין.
human_translation: Rava says Rav Seḥora says Rav Huna says: Wherever the Sages taught by means of a list, there is no significance to the order except for seven substances,
llm_translation: Gemara said Rava said Rav Sechora said Rav Huna: In any place where the sages changed the method of counting, there is no precedence or lateness, except for seven designated signs.

hebrew_text: דִּתְנַן: שִׁבְעָה סַמָּנִין מַעֲבִירִין עַל הַכֶּתֶם – רוֹק תָּפֵל, וּמֵי גְרִיסִין, וּמֵי רַגְלַיִם, וְנֶתֶר, וּבוֹרִית, קִמוֹלְיָא, וְאַשְׁלָךְ.
human_translation: As we learned One applies seven substances to the stain Bland spittle, moisture of grits, urine; natron; lye [ borit ]; Kimolian earth [ kimuleya ]; and potash.
llm_translation: We have learned in a Mishnah: Seven substances remove a stain - saliva, water of crushed figs, water of the feet, urine, dung, soapwort, and lye.

hebrew_text: וְקָתָנֵי סֵיפָא: הֶעֱבִירָן שֶׁלֹּא כְּסִידְרָן, אוֹ שֶׁהֶעֱבִירָן שִׁבְעָתָן כְּאֶחָד – לֹא עָשָׂה וְלֹא כְלוּם.
human_translation: And it is taught the latter clause applied them not in the order for them, or applied all seven of them at once, he has done nothing;
llm_translation: And it is taught in the latter part: If one passed them over not in their proper order, or if he passed them over all seven at once - he has not fulfilled his obligation and has not done anything wrong.

hebrew_text: רַב פָּפָּא סָבָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב אָמַר: אַף אַרְבַּע מִיתוֹת. מִדְּקָא מִפְּלִיג רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ דַּוְקָא קָתָנֵי. וְאִידָּךְ, בִּפְלוּגְתָּא לָא קָא מַיְירֵי.
human_translation: Rav Pappa the elder says in the name of Rav: four types of death also from that Rabbi Shimon disagrees conclude from it it is taught an exact And the other he is not speaking of a dispute
llm_translation: Rav Papa the Elder, from the name of Rav, said: Also four deaths. From when Rabbi Shimon argues, learn from it specifically that he states. And the other, in the dispute, it does not explain.

hebrew_text: רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר: אַף סֵדֶר יוֹמָא, דִּתְנַן: כׇּל מַעֲשֵׂה יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים הָאֲמוּרִים עַל הַסֵּדֶר, אִם הִקְדִּים מַעֲשֶׂה לַחֲבֵירוֹ – לֹא עָשָׂה וְלֹא כְלוּם.
human_translation: Rav Pappa says: The order of the Day also as we learned all actions of Yom Kippur, which are stated in order, If performed action before another, he has done nothing.
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: Even the order of the day, as we learned: All the actions of Yom Kippur that are said in the order, if one preceded his fellow in the action - he has not fulfilled his obligation.

hebrew_text: וְאִידָּךְ, הָהוּא חוּמְרָא בְּעָלְמָא.
human_translation: And the other that is merely a stringency.
llm_translation: And the other, that matter is in general.

hebrew_text: רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אָמַר: אַף סֵדֶר תָּמִיד, דְּקָתָנֵי עֲלַהּ ״זֶהוּ סֵדֶר תָּמִיד״. וְאִידָּךְ – הָהוּא לְמִצְוָה בְּעָלְמָא.
human_translation: Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, says: The order of the daily offering, also as it is taught with regard to it: This is the order of the daily offering, And the other that is merely for the mitzva.
llm_translation: Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said: Also the order of the daily offering, as it is taught regarding it "This is the order of the daily offering." And the other opinion - that statement is for a general commandment.

hebrew_text: וּלְאַפּוֹקֵי מִמִּצְוַת חֲלִיצָה, דִּתְנַן: מִצְוַת חֲלִיצָה – בָּא הוּא וִיבִמְתּוֹ לִפְנֵי בֵּית דִּין, הָיוּ נוֹתְנִין לוֹ עֵצָה הַהוֹגֶנֶת לוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְקָרְאוּ לוֹ זִקְנֵי עִירוֹ וְדִבְּרוּ אֵלָיו״.
human_translation: And excludes the mitzva of the ritual through which a man whose married brother dies childless [ yavam ] frees his late brother’s wife [ yevama ] of her levirate bonds [ ḥalitza ]; As we learned The mitzva of ḥalitza and his yevama come before court, offer him advice that is appropriate for him as it is stated: “And the elders of his city shall call him and speak to him”
llm_translation: And to exempt from the obligation of halitzah, as we learned: The obligation of halitzah - if he comes and refuses to perform halitzah before the court, they would give him advice that benefits him, as it is said: "And his elders shall call him and speak to him."

hebrew_text: וְהִיא אוֹמֶרֶת: ״מֵאֵן יְבָמִי וְגוֹ׳״, וְהוּא אוֹמֵר: ״לֹא חָפַצְתִּי לְקַחְתָּהּ״. וּבִלְשׁוֹן הַקֹּדֶשׁ הָיוּ אוֹמְרִין.
human_translation: And she says: “My brother-in-law refused and he says: “I do not wish to take her” And they would say in the sacred tongue,
llm_translation: And she says: "From my yavam and so forth," and he says: "I did not desire to take her." And in the holy tongue they would say.

hebrew_text: וְנִגְּשָׁה יְבִמְתּוֹ אֵלָיו לְעֵינֵי הַזְּקֵנִים וְחָלְצָה נַעֲלוֹ וְיָרְקָה בְּפָנָיו – רוֹק הַנִּרְאֶה לַדַּיָּינִין. ״וְעָנְתָה וְאָמְרָה כָּכָה יֵעָשֶׂה לְאִישׁ וְגוֹ׳ וְנִקְרָא שְׁמוֹ בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: “His yevama shall approach him, before the elders, and remove his shoe from on his foot and spit before him” spittle that is visible to the judges. “And she shall respond and say: So shall it be done to the man And his name shall be called in Israel:
llm_translation: The yevamah shall approach him before the elders, and she shall remove his shoe and spit before him - the spitting that is visible to the judges. "And she shall answer and say, 'So shall be done to the man, etc.' and his name shall be called in Israel, etc."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: מִצְוַת חֲלִיצָה – קוֹרְאָה וְקוֹרֵא, חוֹלֶצֶת וְרוֹקֶקֶת, וְקוֹרְאָה.
human_translation: And Rav Yehuda says the mitzva of ḥalitza : She recites and he recites she removes and spits, and recites:
llm_translation: And Rav Yehudah said: The commandment of chalitzah - he reads and she reads, she removes and he spits, and she reads.

hebrew_text: וְהָוֵינַן בַּהּ: מַאי קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן? מַתְנִיתִין הִיא! הָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן: מִצְוָה הָכִי, וְאִי אָפֵיךְ – לֵית לַן בַּהּ. תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: בֵּין שֶׁהִקְדִּים חֲלִיצָה לִרְקִיקָה, אוֹ רְקִיקָה לַחֲלִיצָה – מַה שֶּׁעָשָׂה עָשׂוּי.
human_translation: And we discussed it: What is teaching us? This is the mishna. this teaches us: a mitzva like this, but if switched we have no with it; This is also taught Whether performed removal before spitting, or spitting before the removal what did is done,
llm_translation: We were learning in it: What is it teaching us? It is a Mishnah! This is what it is teaching us: If so, we do not have it in it. It was also taught likewise: Whether one designated redemption money for a bird-offering before designating it for a meal-offering, or for a meal-offering before a bird-offering - what he did is valid.

hebrew_text: וּלְאַפּוֹקֵי מֵהָא דִּתְנַן: כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל מְשַׁמֵּשׁ בִּשְׁמוֹנָה כֵּלִים, וְהֶדְיוֹט בְּאַרְבָּעָה. בִּכְתוֹנֶת, בְּמִכְנָסַיִם, בְּמִצְנֶפֶת, וְאַבְנֵט. מוֹסִיף עֲלֵיהֶן כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל: חוֹשֶׁן וְאֵפוֹד וּמְעִיל וְצִיץ.
human_translation: And excludes that which we learned High Priest serves, eight garments, and ordinary four. in a tunic, in trousers, in a mitre, and a belt. High Priest adds beyond those A breastplate, and an ephod, and a robe, and a frontplate.
llm_translation: To go out from that which we learned: A High Priest serves with eight garments, and a common priest with four. With a tunic, with trousers, with a turban, and a sash. Additionally for the High Priest: a breastplate, an ephod, a robe, and a headplate.

hebrew_text: וְתַנְיָא: מִנַּיִן שֶׁלֹּא יְהֵא דָּבָר קוֹדֵם לַמִּכְנָסַיִם? שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּמִכְנְסֵי בַד יִהְיוּ עַל בְּשָׂרוֹ״.
human_translation: And it is taught From where that nothing precedes the trousers As it is stated: and trousers of linen shall be on his flesh”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it was taught in a Baraita: From where do we derive that there should not be a matter before the entrails? As it is stated: "And the entrails and the legs shall be washed with water."

hebrew_text: וְתַנָּא, מַאי טַעְמָא אַקְדְּמֵיהּ לִכְתוֹנֶת? מִשּׁוּם דְּאַקְדְּמֵיהּ קְרָא. וּקְרָא, מַאי טַעְמָא אַקְדְּמֵיהּ? מִשּׁוּם דִּמְכַסְּיָא כּוּלֵּהּ גּוּפֵיהּ, עֲדִיפָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: But what is the reason the tanna the tunic first? Because the verse first. And what is the reason the verse first? Because it covers his entire body, prefers
llm_translation: And it was taught: What is the reason that one should precede the tunic? Because the verse precedes it. And the verse, what is the reason that it precedes? Because it covers his entire body, and it is preferable for him.

hebrew_text: סְקִילָה שְׂרֵיפָה כּוּ׳. סְקִילָה חֲמוּרָה מִשְּׂרֵיפָה, שֶׁכֵּן נִיתְּנָה לִמְגַדֵּף וּלְעוֹבֵד עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה. מַאי חוּמְרָא? שֶׁכֵּן פּוֹשֵׁט יָדוֹ בָּעִיקָּר.
human_translation: Stoning, burning, Stoning severe than burning, as is meted out to one who blasphemes, and to one who worships idols. what severity Because undermines the fundamental
llm_translation: Stoning burning so. Stoning severe than burning, for so given to blasphemer and to worshipper of foreign deity. What severity? For so he fundamentally extends his hand.

hebrew_text: אַדְּרַבָּה: שְׂרֵיפָה חֲמוּרָה, שֶׁכֵּן נִיתְּנָה לְבַת כֹּהֵן שֶׁזִּינְּתָה. וּמַאי חוּמְרָא? שֶׁכֵּן מְחַלֶּלֶת אֶת אָבִיהָ.
human_translation: On the contrary; burning severe as it is meted out to a priest’s daughter who committed adultery And what severity Because she profanes her father
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: Ad'rabbah: Serifah chamurah, sheken nitt'nah l'vat kohen shezinn'tah. U'mai chumra? Sheken mechalelet et aviyah. English translation: Ad'rabbah: Severe burning, for thus it was given to the daughter of a priest who committed adultery. And what is the severity? That she profanes her father.

hebrew_text: קָסָבְרִי רַבָּנַן: נְשׂוּאָה יוֹצְאָה לִשְׂרֵיפָה, וְלֹא אֲרוּסָה. וּמִדְּאַפְּקַהּ רַחֲמָנָא לַאֲרוּסָה בִּסְקִילָה, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: סְקִילָה חֲמוּרָה.
human_translation: The Rabbis hold married is singled out for burning, but not betrothed, And since the Merciful One singles out a betrothed woman by stoning, conclude from it stoning severe
llm_translation: The sages hold: A married woman is liable for burning, but not a betrothed woman. And since the Merciful One was more lenient with a betrothed woman by stoning, learn from it: Stoning is severe.

hebrew_text: סְקִילָה חֲמוּרָה מִסַּיִיף, שֶׁכֵּן נִיתְּנָה לִמְגַדֵּף וּלְעוֹבֵד עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה. וּמַאי חוּמְרָא? כְּדַאֲמַרַן.
human_translation: Stoning severe than sword, as it is meted out to one who blasphemes and to one who worships idols. And what severity As we said,
llm_translation: Stoning severe from sword, for so it was given to blasphemer and to worshipper of foreign worship. And what is the severity? As we said.

hebrew_text: אַדְּרַבָּה: סַיִיף חָמוּר, שֶׁכֵּן נִיתַּן לְאַנְשֵׁי עִיר הַנִּדַּחַת. וּמַאי חוּמְרָא? שֶׁכֵּן מָמוֹנָן אָבֵד.
human_translation: On the contrary; sword severe as it is meted out to the people of an idolatrous city, And what severity Because their property is destroyed
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: Ad'rabbah: sayif chamur, she'ken nitan le'an'shei ir hanidachat. U'mai chumra? She'ken mamonan aved. English translation: Ad'rabbah: a severe sword, as is given to the people of a banished city. And what is the severity? That their wealth is lost.

hebrew_text: אָמַרְתָּ: אֵיזֶה כֹּחַ מְרוּבֶּה, כֹּחַ הַמַּדִּיחַ אוֹ כֹּחַ הַנִּידָּח? הֱוֵי אוֹמֵר: כֹּחַ הַמַּדִּיחַ. וְתַנְיָא: מַדִּיחֵי עִיר הַנִּדַּחַת – בִּסְקִילָה.
human_translation: you say: The severity of which is greater: The severity of the one who subverts or the severity of the subverted? You must say the severity of the subverter And it is taught The subverters of an idolatrous city by stoning.
llm_translation: You said: Which is the greater strength, the strength of the one who pushes away or the strength of the one who is pushed away? One should say: the strength of the one who pushes away. And it was taught: Those who push away the city of the apostate - by stoning.

hebrew_text: סְקִילָה חֲמוּרָה מֵחֶנֶק, שֶׁכֵּן נִיתַּן לִמְגַדֵּף וּלְעוֹבֵד עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה. וּמַאי חוּמְרָא? כְּדַאֲמַרַן.
human_translation: Stoning severe than strangulation, as it is meted out to one who blasphemes and to one who worships idols. And what severity As we said,
llm_translation: Stoning severe from strangulation, for thus given to blasphemer and to worshipper of foreign worship. And what is the severity? As we said.

hebrew_text: אַדְּרַבָּה: חֶנֶק חָמוּר – שֶׁכֵּן נִיתַּן לְמַכֵּה אָבִיו וְאִמּוֹ. וּמַאי חוּמְרָא? שֶׁכֵּן הוּקַּשׁ כְּבוֹדָן לִכְבוֹד הַמָּקוֹם.
human_translation: On the contrary; strangulation severe, as it is meted out to one who wounds his father or his mother. And what severity Because the honor of is compared to the honor of the Omnipresent
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: Ad'Rabba: Henek Chamur - sheken nitan lemakeh aviv ve'imo. U'mai chumra? Sheken hukash kevodan likvod hamakom. English translation: Ad'Rabba: A severe punishment - for it is given to one who strikes his father and mother. And what is the severity? Their honor is equated to the honor of the Omnipresent.

hebrew_text: מִדְּאַפְּקֵיהּ רַחֲמָנָא לַאֲרוּסָה בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל מִכְּלַל נְשׂוּאָה בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל מֵחֶנֶק לִסְקִילָה, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: סְקִילָה חֲמוּרָה.
human_translation: Since the Merciful One singles out a betrothed Jewish woman from the category of a married Jewish woman, from strangulation to stoning, conclude from it stoning severe.
llm_translation: From when the Merciful One has mercy on the betrothed daughter of Israel from the category of marriage, the daughter of Israel from choking to stoning, hear from it: stoning is more severe.

hebrew_text: שְׂרֵיפָה חֲמוּרָה מִסַּיִיף, שֶׁכֵּן נִיתְּנָה לְבַת כֹּהֵן שֶׁזִּינְּתָה. וּמַאי חוּמְרָא? שֶׁכֵּן מְחַלֶּלֶת אֶת אָבִיהָ.
human_translation: Burning severe than sword, as it is meted out to a priest’s daughter who committed adultery. And what severity Because she profanes her father.
llm_translation: Burning is severe from a sword, for thus it was given to the daughter of a priest who committed adultery. And what is the severity? That she profanes her father.

hebrew_text: אַדְּרַבָּה: סַיִיף חָמוּר, שֶׁכֵּן נִיתַּן לְאַנְשֵׁי עִיר הַנִּדַּחַת. וּמַאי חוּמְרָא? שֶׁכֵּן מָמוֹנָן אָבֵד.
human_translation: On the contrary; sword severe, as it is meted out to the people of an idolatrous city. And what severity Because their property is destroyed
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: Ad'rabbah: sayif chamur, she'ken nitan le'an'shei ir hanidachat. U'mai chumra? She'ken mamonan aved. English translation: Ad'rabbah: a severe punishment, as it is given to the people of a banished city. And what is the severity? Their wealth is lost.

hebrew_text: נֶאֱמַר ״אָבִיהָ״ בִּסְקִילָה, וְנֶאֱמַר ״אָבִיהָ״ בִּשְׂרֵיפָה. מָה ״אָבִיהָ״ הָאָמוּר בִּסְקִילָה – סְקִילָה חֲמוּרָה מִסַּיִיף, אַף ״אָבִיהָ״ הָאָמוּר בִּשְׂרֵיפָה – שְׂרֵיפָה חֲמוּרָה מִסַּיִיף.
human_translation: “her father” is stated with regard to stoning, and “her father” is stated with regard to burning, just as “her father” that is stated with regard to stoning stoning severe than sword, so too, “her father” that is stated with regard to burning, burning severe than sword.
llm_translation: It is stated "her father" in stoning, and it is stated "her father" in burning. Just as "her father" mentioned in stoning is more severe than the sword, so too "her father" mentioned in burning is more severe than the sword.

hebrew_text: שְׂרֵיפָה חֲמוּרָה מֵחֶנֶק, שֶׁכֵּן נִיתְּנָה לְבַת כֹּהֵן שֶׁזִּינְּתָה. וּמַאי חוּמְרָא? כְּדַאֲמַרַן.
human_translation: Burning severe than strangulation, as it is meted out to a priest’s daughter who committed adultery. And what severity As we said,
llm_translation: Burning is more stringent than strangulation, as it was given to the daughter of a priest who committed adultery. And what is the stringency? As we said.

hebrew_text: אַדְּרַבָּה: חֶנֶק חָמוּר, שֶׁכֵּן נִיתַּן לְמַכֵּה אָבִיו וְאִמּוֹ. וּמַאי חוּמְרָא? שֶׁכֵּן הוּקַּשׁ כְּבוֹדָן לִכְבוֹד הַמָּקוֹם.
human_translation: On the contrary; strangulation severe, as it is meted out to one who wounds his father or his mother. And what severity Because the honor of is compared to the honor of the Omnipresent.
llm_translation: Ad Ravva: Henek chamur, sheken nitan lemakeh aviv veimo. Umai chumra? Sheken hukash kevodan likvod hamakom.

hebrew_text: מִדְּאַפְּקֵיהּ רַחֲמָנָא לִנְשׂוּאָה בַּת כֹּהֵן מִכְּלַל נְשׂוּאָה בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל מֵחֶנֶק לִשְׂרֵיפָה, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: שְׂרֵיפָה חֲמוּרָה.
human_translation: Since the Merciful One singles out the married daughter of a priest from the category of a married Jewish woman, from strangulation to burning, conclude from it burning severe
llm_translation: From when the Merciful One distinguished between the daughter of a Kohen for marriage, from the category of the daughter of an Israelite for choking to burning, learn from it: burning is severe.

hebrew_text: סַיִיף חָמוּר מֵחֶנֶק, שֶׁכֵּן נִיתַּן לְאַנְשֵׁי עִיר הַנִּדַּחַת. וּמַאי חוּמְרָא? שֶׁכֵּן מָמוֹנָם אָבֵד.
human_translation: sword severe than strangulation, as it is meted out to the people of an idolatrous city. And what severity Because their property is destroyed
llm_translation: The sword is more severe than strangulation, as it is given to the people of a city that has been condemned. And what is the severity? Their wealth is lost.

hebrew_text: אַדְּרַבָּה: חֶנֶק חָמוּר שֶׁכֵּן נִיתַּן לְמַכֵּה אָבִיו וְאִמּוֹ. וּמַאי חוּמְרָא? שֶׁכֵּן הוּקַּשׁ כּוּ׳.
human_translation: On the contrary; strangulation severe, as it is meted out to one who wounds his father or his mother. And what severity Because is compared
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: Ad'rabba: Henek chamur sheken nitan lemakeh aviv ve'imo. U'mai chumra? Sheken hukash ku'. English translation: Greater severity: Strangulation is so severe that it is given for striking one's father and mother. And what is the severity? It is so because it is compared to a verse.

hebrew_text: אֲפִילּוּ הָכִי, פּוֹשֵׁט יָדוֹ בָּעִיקָּר עָדִיף.
human_translation: Nevertheless, one who undermines the fundamental more
llm_translation: Even so, he stretches out his hand to the core is preferable.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר כּוּ׳. שְׂרֵיפָה חֲמוּרָה מִסְּקִילָה, שֶׁכֵּן נִיתְּנָה לְבַת כֹּהֵן שֶׁזִּינְּתָה. וּמַאי חוּמְרָא? שֶׁכֵּן מְחַלֶּלֶת אֶת אָבִיהָ.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says Burning severe than stoning, as is meted out to a priest’s daughter who committed adultery. And what severity Because she profanes her father.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: "Burning is more severe than stoning, as it was given to the daughter of a Kohen who committed adultery. And what is the severity? Because she profanes her father."

hebrew_text: אַדְּרַבָּה: סְקִילָה חֲמוּרָה, שֶׁכֵּן נִיתְּנָה לִמְגַדֵּף וּלְעוֹבֵד עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה. וּמַאי חוּמְרָא? שֶׁכֵּן פּוֹשֵׁט יָדוֹ בָּעִיקָּר.
human_translation: On the contrary; stoning severe, as it is meted out to one who blasphemes and to one who worships idols. And what severity Because undermines the fundamental
llm_translation: The Gemara: Stoning is severe, as it was given for one who curses and worships idols. And what is the severity? Because he fundamentally denies.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן לְטַעְמֵיהּ, דְּאָמַר: אַחַת אֲרוּסָה וְאַחַת נְשׂוּאָה יָצְאָה לִשְׂרֵיפָה. וּמִדְּאַפְּקֵיהּ רַחֲמָנָא לַאֲרוּסָה בַּת כֹּהֵן מִכְּלַל אֲרוּסָה בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל מִסְּקִילָה לִשְׂרֵיפָה, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: שְׂרֵיפָה חֲמוּרָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon to his reasoning, as he says whether betrothed or married, is singled out for burning. And since the Merciful One singles out the betrothed daughter of a priest from the category of a betrothed Jewish woman, from stoning to burning, conclude from it burning severe
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon according to his reasoning, as he said: one betrothed and one married went out to be burned. And from the fact that the Merciful One makes a distinction for the betrothed, a daughter of a Kohen, from the general category of a betrothed daughter of Israel, to be stoned, learn from it: burning is more severe.

hebrew_text: שְׂרֵיפָה חֲמוּרָה מֵחֶנֶק, שֶׁכֵּן נִיתְּנָה לְבַת כֹּהֵן שֶׁזִּינְּתָה. וּמַאי חוּמְרָא? כְּדַאֲמַרַן.
human_translation: Burning severe than strangulation, as it is meted out to a priest’s daughter who committed adultery. And what severity As we said,
llm_translation: Burning is more stringent than strangulation, as it was given to the daughter of a priest who committed adultery. And what is the stringency? As we said.

hebrew_text: אַדְּרַבָּה: חֶנֶק חָמוּר, שֶׁכֵּן נִיתַּן לְמַכֵּה אָבִיו וְאִמּוֹ. וּמַאי חוּמְרָא? שֶׁכֵּן הוּקַּשׁ כְּבוֹדָם לִכְבוֹד הַמָּקוֹם.
human_translation: On the contrary; strangulation severe, as it is meted out to one who wounds his father or his mother. And what severity Because the honor of is compared to the honor of the Omnipresent.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: Ad'rabbah: Henek chamur, sheken nitan lemakeh aviv ve'imo. U'mai chumra? Sheken hukash kevodo l'kavod hamakom. English translation: Greater is the severity of choking, for it is given to one who strikes his father and mother. And what is the severity? Their honor is equated to the honor of the Omnipresent.

hebrew_text: מִדְּאַפְּקֵיהּ רַחֲמָנָא לִנְשׂוּאָה בַּת כֹּהֵן מִכְּלַל נְשׂוּאָה בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל, מֵחֶנֶק לִשְׂרֵיפָה, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: שְׂרֵיפָה חֲמוּרָה.
human_translation: Since the Merciful One singles out the married daughter of a priest from the category of a married Jewish woman from strangulation to burning, conclude from it burning severe
llm_translation: From when the Merciful One distinguished between the daughter of a Kohen for marriage from the general category of the daughter of an Israelite, from choking to burning, infer from it: burning is more severe.

hebrew_text: שְׂרֵיפָה חֲמוּרָה מִסַּיִיף, שֶׁכֵּן נִיתְּנָה לְבַת כֹּהֵן שֶׁזִּינְּתָה. וּמַאי חוּמְרָא? כְּדַאֲמַרַן.
human_translation: Burning severe than sword, as it is meted out to a priest’s daughter who committed adultery. And what severity As we said,
llm_translation: Burning is severe from a sword, as it was given to the daughter of a priest who committed adultery. And what is the severity? As we said.

hebrew_text: אַדְּרַבָּה: סַיִיף חָמוּר, שֶׁכֵּן נִיתַּן לְאַנְשֵׁי עִיר הַנִּדַּחַת. וּמַאי חוּמְרָא? שֶׁכֵּן מָמוֹנָם אָבֵד.
human_translation: On the contrary; sword severe, as it is meted out to the people of an idolatrous city. And what severity Because their property is destroyed
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: Ad'rabbah: sayif chamur, sheken nitan le'anshei ir hanidachat. U'mai chumra? Sheken mamonam aved. English translation: Ad'rabbah: a severe punishment, as it is given to the people of a banished city. And what is the severity? That their wealth is lost.

hebrew_text: אָמַרְתָּ: וְכִי אֵיזֶה כֹּחַ מְרוּבֶּה, כֹּחַ הַמַּדִּיחַ אוֹ כֹּחַ הַנִּידָּח?
human_translation: you say: But the severity of which is greater: The severity of the subverter, or the severity of the subverted?
llm_translation: You said: And which is the greater strength, the strength of the one who pushes away or the strength of the one who is pushed away?

hebrew_text: הֱוֵי אוֹמֵר: כֹּחַ הַמַּדִּיחַ. וְקַל וָחוֹמֶר: וּמָה חֶנֶק, שֶׁחָמוּר מִסַּיִיף – שְׂרֵיפָה חֲמוּרָה מִמֶּנּוּ; סַיִיף הַקַּל – לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן?
human_translation: You must say the severity of the subverter And a fortiori if strangulation, which severe than sword, burning severe than it, not all the more so sword, which is lenient
llm_translation: Be it said: the force of the one who pushes. And an a fortiori argument: And if strangulation, which is more severe than the sword - severe burning more so; the light sword - all the more so not?

hebrew_text: סְקִילָה חֲמוּרָה מֵחֶנֶק, שֶׁכֵּן נִיתְּנָה לִמְגַדֵּף וּלְעוֹבֵד עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה. וּמַאי חוּמְרָא? כְּדַאֲמַרַן.
human_translation: Stoning severe than strangulation, as it is meted out to one who blasphemes and to one who worships idols. And what severity As we said,
llm_translation: Stoning severe more than strangulation, for so it was given to a blasphemer and to one who worships foreign worship. And what is the stringency? As we said.

hebrew_text: אַדְּרַבָּה: חֶנֶק חָמוּר, שֶׁכֵּן נִיתַּן לְמַכֵּה אָבִיו וְאִמּוֹ. וּמַאי חוּמְרָא? שֶׁכֵּן הוּקַּשׁ כּוּ׳.
human_translation: On the contrary; strangulation severe, as it is meted out to one who wounds his father or his mother. And what severity Because is compared
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: Ad'rabbah: Henek chamur, sheken nitan lemakeh aviv ve'imo. U'mai chumra? Sheken huqash ku'. English translation: Ad'rabbah: A severe punishment, for it is given to one who strikes his father and mother. And what is the severity? For it is equated with a quote.

hebrew_text: מִדְּאַפְּקֵיהּ רַחֲמָנָא לַאֲרוּסָה בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל מִכְּלַל נְשׂוּאָה בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל מֵחֶנֶק לִסְקִילָה, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: סְקִילָה חֲמוּרָה.
human_translation: Since the Merciful One singles out the betrothed daughter of a non-priest from the category of a married Jewish woman from strangulation to stoning, conclude from it stoning severe.
llm_translation: From when the Merciful One has mercy on the betrothed daughter of Israel from the category of marriage, the daughter of Israel from choking to stoning, hear from it: stoning is severe.

hebrew_text: סְקִילָה חֲמוּרָה מִסַּיִיף, שֶׁכֵּן נִיתְּנָה לַמְגַדֵּף כּוּ׳. אַדְּרַבָּה: סַיִיף חָמוּר שֶׁכֵּן נִיתַּן לְאַנְשֵׁי עִיר הַנִּדַּחַת. וּמַאי חוּמְרָא? שֶׁכֵּן מָמוֹנָם אָבֵד.
human_translation: Stoning severe than sword, as it is meted out to one who blasphemes On the contrary; sword severe, as it is meted out to the people of an idolatrous city. And what severity Because their property is destroyed
llm_translation: Stoning severe from sword, as so given to blasphemer. On the contrary: sword severe as so given to people of city that is excommunicated. And what is the severity? Their money is lost.

hebrew_text: אָמַרְתָּ: וְכִי אֵיזֶה כֹּחַ מְרוּבֶּה, כֹּחַ הַמַּדִּיחַ אוֹ כֹּחַ הַנִּידָּח? הֱוֵי אוֹמֵר כֹּחַ הַמַּדִּיחַ. וְקַל וָחוֹמֶר: וּמָה חֶנֶק שֶׁחָמוּר מִסַּיִיף, סְקִילָה חֲמוּרָה מִמֶּנּוּ; סַיִיף הַקַּל – לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן?
human_translation: you say: But the severity of which is greater: The severity of the subverter, or the severity of the subverted? You must say the severity of the subverter And a fortiori if strangulation, which severe than sword, stoning is severe than it, not all the more so sword, which is lenient
llm_translation: You said: And which is a greater force, the force that pushes away or the force that repels? One should say the force that pushes away. And a fortiori: Just as strangulation, which is severe than the sword, is more severe than stoning; the sword, which is lighter - all the more so?

hebrew_text: חֶנֶק חָמוּר מִסַּיִיף, שֶׁכֵּן נִיתַּן לְמַכֵּה אָבִיו וְאִמּוֹ. וּמַאי חוּמְרָא? כְּדַאֲמַרַן.
human_translation: Strangulation severe than sword, as it is meted out to one who wounds his father or his mother. And what severity As we said,
llm_translation: Strangulation is more severe than the sword, as it is punishable by death for striking one's father or mother. And what is the severity? As we have said.

hebrew_text: אַדְּרַבָּה: סַיִיף חָמוּר שֶׁכֵּן נִיתַּן לְאַנְשֵׁי עִיר הַנִּדַּחַת. וּמַאי חוּמְרָא? שֶׁכֵּן מָמוֹנָם אָבֵד.
human_translation: On the contrary; sword severe, as it is meted out to the people of an idolatrous city. And what severity Because their property is destroyed
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: Ad'rabbah: sayif chamur sheken nitan le'anshei ir hanidachat. U'mai chumra? Sheken mamonam aved. English translation: Ad'rabbah: A severe sword that is given to the people of a banished city. And what is the severity? That their wealth is lost.

hebrew_text: אָמַרְתָּ: וְכִי אֵיזֶה כֹּחַ מְרוּבֶּה, כֹּחַ הַמַּדִּיחַ אוֹ כֹּחַ הַנִּידָּח? הֱוֵי אוֹמֵר: כֹּחַ הַמַּדִּיחַ. וְתַנְיָא: מַדִּיחֵי עִיר הַנִּדַּחַת בִּסְקִילָה. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: בְּחֶנֶק.
human_translation: you say But the severity of which is greater: The severity of the subverter, or the severity of the subverted? You must say the severity of the subverter and it is taught The subverters of an idolatrous city by stoning. Rabbi Shimon says: By strangulation.
llm_translation: You said: And which is the greater power, the power of the one who pushes away or the power of the one who is pushed away? One should say: the power of the one who pushes away. And it was taught: The pushers of the city that is to be destroyed are stoned. Rabbi Shimon says: by strangulation.

hebrew_text: מַרְגְּלָא בְּפוּמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: נַעֲרָה הַמְאוֹרָסָה בַּת כֹּהֵן שֶׁזִּינְּתָה – בִּסְקִילָה. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: בִּשְׂרֵיפָה. זִינְּתָה מֵאָבִיהָ – בִּסְקִילָה. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: בִּשְׂרֵיפָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan was wont to say betrothed young woman the daughter of a priest who committed adultery by stoning. Rabbi Shimon says: by burning. engaged in intercourse with her father by stoning. Rabbi Shimon says: By burning.
llm_translation: The foot of Rabbi Yochanan: A betrothed maiden, daughter of a Kohen, who committed adultery - is punished by stoning. Rabbi Shimon says: by burning. If she was seduced by her father - she is punished by stoning. Rabbi Shimon says: by burning.

hebrew_text: מַאי קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן? לְרַבָּנַן – נְשׂוּאָה יָצְאָה לִשְׂרֵיפָה, וְלֹא אֲרוּסָה. לְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן – אַחַת אֲרוּסָה וְאַחַת נְשׂוּאָה יָצְאָה לִשְׂרֵיפָה. וְטַעְמָא מַאי? מִשּׁוּם דִּלְרַבָּנַן סְקִילָה חֲמוּרָה, לְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן שְׂרֵיפָה חֲמוּרָה.
human_translation: What does teach us? according to the Rabbis, the married is singled out for burning, and not a betrothed According to Rabbi Shimon, whether betrothed or married, is singled out for burning. And what is the reason because according to the Rabbis stoning severe according to Rabbi Shimon burning severe.
llm_translation: What is it teaching us? According to the Rabbis - a married woman is liable for burning, but a betrothed woman is not. According to Rabbi Shimon - whether betrothed or married, she is liable for burning. And the reason is what? Because for the Rabbis, stoning is more severe, while for Rabbi Shimon, burning is more severe.

hebrew_text: נָפְקָא מִינַּהּ לְמִי שֶׁנִּתְחַיֵּיב שְׁתֵּי מִיתוֹת בֵּית דִּין, נִידּוֹן בַּחֲמוּרָה.
human_translation: difference that one who was sentenced to two court death is punished with the severe
llm_translation: He went out from her to one who is liable for two death penalties by the court, he shall be judged severely.

hebrew_text: מַאי רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן? דְּתַנְיָא: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר, שְׁנֵי כְּלָלוֹת נֶאֶמְרוּ בְּבַת כֹּהֵן.
human_translation: What Rabbi Shimon As it is taught Rabbi Shimon says: Two general are stated with regard to the daughter of a priest,
llm_translation: What is the opinion of Rabbi Shimon? For it was taught: Rabbi Shimon says, two general principles were stated in the daughter of a Kohen.

hebrew_text: בְּבַת כֹּהֵן, וְלֹא בְּבַת יִשְׂרָאֵל?! אֵימָא: אַף בְּבַת כֹּהֵן.
human_translation: with regard to the daughter of a priest, and not with regard to the daughter of a non-priest? say: with regard to the daughter of a priest as well.
llm_translation: In the daughter of a Kohen, and not in the daughter of Yisrael?! Say: Also in the daughter of a Kohen.

hebrew_text: וְהוֹצִיא הַכָּתוּב נְשׂוּאָה מִכְּלַל נְשׂוּאָה, וַאֲרוּסָה מִכְּלַל אֲרוּסָה.
human_translation: And the verse singles out married from the category of married woman, and betrothed from the category of betrothed woman,
llm_translation: And the Scripture brings out "nesu'ah" from the category of "nesu'ah," and "erusah" from the category of "erusah."

hebrew_text: מָה כְּשֶׁהוֹצִיא הַכָּתוּב נְשׂוּאָה מִכְּלַל נְשׂוּאָה לְהַחְמִיר, אַף כְּשֶׁהוֹצִיא הַכָּתוּב אֲרוּסָה מִכְּלַל אֲרוּסָה לְהַחֲמִיר.
human_translation: just as when the verse singles out married from the category of a married woman to render severe, so too, when the verse singles out betrothed from the category of a betrothed woman to render severe.
llm_translation: What when the Scripture brought out "nesu'ah" from the category of "nesu'ah" to be stringent, so too when the Scripture brought out "arusah" from the category of "arusah" to be stringent.

hebrew_text: זוֹמְמֵי נְשׂוּאָה בַּת כֹּהֵן, בִּכְלַל זוֹמְמֵי נְשׂוּאָה בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל; וְזוֹמְמֵי אֲרוּסָה בַּת כֹּהֵן, בִּכְלַל זוֹמְמֵי אֲרוּסָה בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל.
human_translation: the conspiring witnesses concerning the married daughter of a priest, is included in the conspiring witnesses concerning the married daughter of a non-priest, and the conspiring witnesses concerning the betrothed daughter of a priest is included in the conspiring witnesses concerning the betrothed daughter of a non-priest.
llm_translation: Those who plot against the daughter of a Kohen, are included in those who plot against the daughter of an Israelite; and those who plot against the betrothed daughter of a Kohen, are included in those who plot against the betrothed daughter of an Israelite.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״וּבַת אִישׁ כֹּהֵן כִּי תֵחֵל״ – יָכוֹל אֲפִילּוּ חִלְּלָה אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״לִזְנוֹת״ – בְּחִילּוּלִין שֶׁבִּזְנוּת הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר.
human_translation: The Sages taught: “And the daughter of a priest [ ish kohen ], when she profanes might even desecrated [ ḥillela ] Shabbat; the verse states: “By playing the harlot”; the verse is speaking of profanation through promiscuity.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: "And the daughter of a Kohen, if she profanes herself" - Could it be that even if she desecrates the Sabbath? The verse teaches us "to commit harlotry" - in matters of harlotry that the Scripture speaks.

hebrew_text: יָכוֹל אֲפִילּוּ פְּנוּיָה? נֶאֱמַר כָּאן ״אָבִיהָ״, וְנֶאֱמַר לְהַלָּן ״אָבִיהָ״. מָה לְהַלָּן זְנוּת עִם זִיקַת הַבַּעַל, אַף כָּאן זְנוּת עִם זִיקַת הַבַּעַל.
human_translation: might even unmarried here it is stated: “Her father,” and there it is stated her father” Just as there, promiscuous intercourse a bond to a husband, so too here, promiscuous intercourse a bond to a husband.
llm_translation: One might have thought even a betrothed woman? It is stated here "her father," and it is stated elsewhere "her father." Just as there, it is referring to promiscuity with the husband's consent, so too here it is referring to promiscuity with the husband's consent.

hebrew_text: אוֹ אֵינוֹ אוֹמֵר ״אָבִיהָ״ אֶלָּא לְהוֹצִיא אֶת כׇּל הָאָדָם? כְּשֶׁהוּא אוֹמֵר ״הִיא מְחַלֶּלֶת״, הֱוֵי כָּל אָדָם אָמוּר.
human_translation: Or states “her father” only to exclude all men when it states “she profanes,” all men are stated,
llm_translation: Or does he not say "her father" except to exclude all people? When he says "she is desecrating," it is as if all people are saying.

hebrew_text: הָא מָה אֲנִי מְקַיֵּים ״אָבִיהָ״? נֶאֱמַר כָּאן ״אָבִיהָ״, וְנֶאֱמַר לְהַלָּן ״אָבִיהָ״. מָה לְהַלָּן זְנוּת עִם זִיקַת הַבַּעַל, אַף כָּאן זְנוּת עִם זִיקַת הַבַּעַל.
human_translation: how do I realize her father”? Here it is stated: “Her father,” and there it is stated: “Her father.” Just as there, promiscuous intercourse a bond to a husband, so too here, promiscuous intercourse a bond to a husband.
llm_translation: The Gemara asks: How do I fulfill "her father"? It says here "her father," and it says there "her father." Just as there, it refers to illicit relations with the husband, so too here it refers to illicit relations with the husband.

hebrew_text: אִי מָה לְהַלָּן נַעֲרָה וְהִיא אֲרוּסָה, אַף כָּאן נַעֲרָה וְהִיא אֲרוּסָה? נַעֲרָה וְהִיא נְשׂוּאָה, בּוֹגֶרֶת וְהִיא אֲרוּסָה, בּוֹגֶרֶת וְהִיא נְשׂוּאָה, וַאֲפִילּוּ הִזְקִינָה – מִנַּיִן?
human_translation: If just as there a young woman, who is betrothed, so too here, a young woman who is betrothed. a young woman who is married, a grown woman who is betrothed, a grown woman who is married, or even grew old, from where
llm_translation: There, a young woman who is betrothed, so too here, a young woman who is betrothed? A young woman who is married, and she is betrothed, a virgin who is betrothed, and she is married, a widow who is betrothed, and she is married, and even if she is elderly - from where?

hebrew_text: תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״וּבַת כֹּהֵן״ – מִכׇּל מָקוֹם.
human_translation: The verse states: “And the daughter of a priest,” in any case.
llm_translation: The Talmud teaches: "And the daughter of a Kohen" - from any place.

human_translation: “The daughter of a priest.”
llm_translation: "Bat Kohen"

hebrew_text: אֵין לִי אֶלָּא שֶׁנִּיסֵּת לְכֹהֵן. נִיסֵּת לְלֵוִי וּלְיִשְׂרָאֵל, לְכוּתִי, לְחָלָל, לְמַמְזֵר וּלְנָתִין – מִנַּיִין? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וּבַת אִישׁ כֹּהֵן״, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵינָהּ כֹּהֶנֶת.
human_translation: I have only who married a priest. From where she married a Levite or an Israelite, a Samaritan, a priest disqualified due to flawed lineage [ ḥalal ], a son born from an incestuous or adulterous relationship [ mamzer ], or a Gibeonite? The verse states: “And the daughter of a priest,” even if she is not a priestess,
llm_translation: I have only tried for a Kohen. I tried for a Levi and for an Israelite, for a Kutite, for a Halal, for a Mamzer, and for a Natin – from where? The Talmud teaches: "And the daughter of a Kohen," even though she is not a Kohenet.

hebrew_text: ״הִיא״ בִּשְׂרֵיפָה, וְאֵין בּוֹעֲלָהּ בִּשְׂרֵיפָה. ״הִיא״ בִּשְׂרֵיפָה, וְאֵין זוֹמְמֶיהָ בִּשְׂרֵיפָה.
human_translation: “She by burning, but her paramour not by burning; “she” by burning, but her conspiring witnesses not by burning.
llm_translation: "She" in burning, and one does not have intercourse with her in burning. "She" in burning, and her conspirators are not burned.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: אֶת אָבִיהָ בִּשְׂרֵיפָה, וְאֶת חָמִיהָ בִּסְקִילָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: with her father by burning, and with her father-in-law by stoning,
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: Her father with burning, and her mother-in-law with stoning.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: יָכוֹל אֲפִילּוּ חִילְּלָה שַׁבָּת? חִילְּלָה שַׁבָּת – בַּת סְקִילָה הִיא!
human_translation: The Master said might even desecrated Shabbat she desecrated Shabbat she is liable to stoning,
llm_translation: Master said: Is it possible even to desecrate the Sabbath? Desecration of the Sabbath - it is as if one were liable to stoning!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר רָבָא: הָא מַנִּי? רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן הִיא, דְּאָמַר שְׂרֵיפָה חֲמוּרָה. סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: הוֹאִיל וְאַחְמֵיר בְּהוּ רַחֲמָנָא בְּכָהֲנֵי, דְּרַבִּי בְּהוּ מִצְוֹת יְתֵירוֹת – תִּידּוֹן בִּשְׂרֵיפָה! קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: Rava says: whose is this? It is Rabbi Shimon, who says burning severe enter your mind to say since the Merciful One treats priests stringently, that He gave them additional mitzvot, should be punished by burning, teaches us
llm_translation: Rava said: Is this a question? It is Rabbi Shimon, who said that burning is severe. If you were to ask my opinion, I would say: Since the Merciful One was stringent with the priests, regarding Rabbi with additional commandments – they should be judged with burning! This is what we have heard.

hebrew_text: מַאי שְׁנָא מִינֵּיהּ דִּידֵיהּ?
human_translation: what is different from himself?
llm_translation: What is different about his species?

hebrew_text: סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: אִיהוּ, דְּאִישְׁתַּרְיָא לֵיהּ שַׁבָּת לְגַבֵּי עֲבוֹדָה; הִיא, כֵּיוָן דְּלָא אִשְׁתַּרְיָא שַׁבָּת לְגַבַּהּ, אֵימָא תִּידּוֹן בִּשְׂרֵיפָה. קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: enter your mind to say himself, as Shabbat permitted to him with regard to service. her, since Shabbat not permitted to her say she should be punished by burning, teaches us
llm_translation: I ascend of your opinion: He, that it is permitted to him Sabbath for work; She, since it is not permitted Sabbath for her, she might say let us judge by burning. It is heard to us.

hebrew_text: יָכוֹל אֲפִילּוּ פְּנוּיָה? הָא ״לִזְנוֹת״ כְּתִיב!
human_translation: might even unmarried Isn’t it written by playing the harlot [ liznot ]”?
llm_translation: It is possible even for a single woman? Behold, "for harlotry" is written!

hebrew_text: כִּדְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, דְּאָמַר: פָּנוּי הַבָּא עַל הַפְּנוּיָה שֶׁלֹּא לְשׁוּם אִישׁוּת – עֲשָׂאָהּ זוֹנָה.
human_translation: in accordance with of Rabbi Elazar, who says: An unmarried man who engages in intercourse with an unmarried woman, not for the purpose of marriage, has rendered her a zona ,
llm_translation: As Rabbi Elazar said: "One who engages in relations with a woman who is available for relations without any commitment - he has made her into a prostitute."

hebrew_text: אוֹ אֵינוֹ אוֹמֵר ״אָבִיהָ״ אֶלָּא לְהוֹצִיא אֶת כׇּל אָדָם? אֶלָּא מַאי נִיהוּ – שֶׁזִּינְּתָה מֵאָבִיהָ? מַאי אִירְיָא בַּת כֹּהֵן? אֲפִילּוּ בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל נָמֵי!
human_translation: Or states “her father” only in order to exclude all men Rather, what is where she engaged in intercourse with her father? why specifically the daughter of a priest? Even the daughter of a non-priest
llm_translation: Or does he not say "her father" except to exclude all men? Rather, what is the reason? Because she was fed by her father? What is the difference with the daughter of a priest? Even the daughter of an Israelite also!

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר רָבָא: אֲמַר לִי רַב יִצְחָק בַּר אֲבוּדִימִי, אָתְיָא ״הֵנָּה״ ״הֵנָּה״.
human_translation: As Rava said: Rav Yitzḥak bar Avudimi said to me: derived henna henna
llm_translation: Rava said: Rav Yitzchak bar Avudimi told me, "Hinei, hinei" has come.

hebrew_text: אָתְיָא ״זִמָּה״ ״זִמָּה״.
human_translation: derived “lewdness” “lewdness”
llm_translation: It is taught: "Zimah" "Zimah."

hebrew_text: אִיצְטְרִיךְ, סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: קְרָא לְאַפּוֹקֵי מִדְּרָבָא, מִדְּגַלִּי רַחֲמָנָא בְּבַת כֹּהֵן וְלֹא בְּבַת יִשְׂרָאֵל. קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: was necessary enter your mind to say the verse to exclude of Rava From that the Merciful One revealed with regard to the daughter of a priest and not with regard to the daughter of a non-priest, teaches us
llm_translation: It is necessary, as your mind desires, I say: "He called the daughter of a Kohen to be married to a Torah scholar, not to a daughter of Yisrael." This is what we have heard.

hebrew_text: בַּת כֹּהֵן – אֵין לִי אֶלָּא שֶׁנִּיסֵּת לְכֹהֵן. נִיסֵּת לְלֵוִי, לְיִשְׂרָאֵל, וּלְכוּתִי, וּלְחַלֵּל, לְנָתִין, וּלְמַמְזֵר מִנַּיִין? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״בַּת אִישׁ כֹּהֵן״ – אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵינָהּ כֹּהֶנֶת.
human_translation: “the daughter of a priest,” I have only who married a priest. From where she married a Levite, an Israelite, a Samaritan, a ḥalal , a Gibeonite, or a mamzer ? The verse states: “And the daughter of a priest,” even if she is not a priestess.
llm_translation: Daughter of a Kohen - I have only that she was tested for a Kohen. If she was tested for a Levi, for an Israelite, for a Kutite, for a Halal, for a Natin, and for a Mamzer, from where do we know? The Talmud teaches: "Daughter of a man who is a Kohen" - even though she is not a Kohenet.

hebrew_text: מִשּׁוּם דְּאִינַּסְבָא לְהוּ לְהָנֵי, לָאו בַּת כֹּהֵן הִיא? וְתוּ, מִידֵּי ״כֹּהֶנֶת לְכֹהֵן״ כְּתִיב?
human_translation: Because she married these is she no the daughter of a priest? And furthermore, is it written: A priestess a priest?
llm_translation: On account of that he is not fitting for them, is she not the daughter of a Kohen? And furthermore, is it not written, "A Kohen's daughter to a Kohen"?

hebrew_text: סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: כִּי ״תֵחֵל לִזְנוֹת״ אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא, הָנֵי מִילֵּי הֵיכָא דְּקָא מַתְחֲלָא הַשְׁתָּא, אֲבָל הָא, כֵּיוָן דְּקָא מַתְחֲלָא וְקָיְימָא מֵעִיקָּרָא.
human_translation: enter your mind to say the Merciful One states: “When she profanes herself by playing the harlot,” this matter where she profanes herself now But this since she is already profaned from the outset,
llm_translation: I would say: When "she begins to commit harlotry" - the Merciful One said, these words apply where the condition is worsening now, but here, once it has worsened and is established from the outset.

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר מָר: ״וּבַת כֹּהֵן כִּי תִהְיֶה לְאִישׁ זָר״, כֵּיוָן שֶׁנִּבְעֲלָה לְפָסוּל לָהּ – פְּסָלָהּ.
human_translation: As the Master said, “And if a priest’s daughter be married to a non-priest, once she engaged in intercourse with one who is unfit for her, he has disqualified her
llm_translation: The Master said: "And the daughter of a Kohen, when she becomes married to a stranger," once she becomes disqualified for her, she is disqualified.

hebrew_text: לְלֵוִי וְיִשְׂרָאֵל נָמֵי, ״וְשָׁבָה אֶל בֵּית אָבִיהָ כִּנְעוּרֶיהָ״, מִכְּלָל דְּכִי אִיתֵיהּ גַּבֵּיהּ לָא אָכְלָה,
human_translation: to a Levite or an Israelite, also and returns to her father’s house, as in her youth, By inference, while she is with she does not partake
llm_translation: Levi and Israel, they say, "And she shall return to her father's house as in her youth," from which it is inferred that if her husband is not to her liking, she does not eat.

hebrew_text: אֵימָא: לָא תִּידּוֹן בִּשְׂרֵיפָה. קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: say she should not be punished by burning, teaches us
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Eima: la tidon bisreifah. Ka mashma lan. English translation: Say: Do not judge with burning. It is inferred to us.

hebrew_text: וּדְלָא כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר, דְּתַנְיָא: בַּת כֹּהֵן שֶׁנִּיסֵּת לְיִשְׂרָאֵל וְאָכְלָה תְּרוּמָה – מְשַׁלֶּמֶת אֶת הַקֶּרֶן וְאֵינָהּ מְשַׁלֶּמֶת אֶת הַחוֹמֶשׁ, וּמִיתָתָהּ בִּשְׂרֵיפָה.
human_translation: And not in accordance with Rabbi Meir. As it is taught a priest’s daughter who married an Israelite and partook of teruma , she pays the principal, but she does not pay the one-fifth, And, her death by burning.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And not like Rabbi Meir, as it was taught: A daughter of a Kohen who married an Israelite and ate Terumah - she pays the principal but does not pay the additional fifth, and her death is by burning.

hebrew_text: נִיסֵּת לְאֶחָד מִן הַפְּסוּלִין – מְשַׁלֶּמֶת קֶרֶן וָחוֹמֶשׁ, וּמִיתָתָהּ בְּחֶנֶק. דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר.
human_translation: she married one of the unfit she pays the principal and the one-fifth, And her death by strangulation, the statement of Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: A case occurred to one of the disqualified - she pays the principal and a fifth, and her death is by strangulation. The words of Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: זוֹ וָזוֹ מְשַׁלְּמוֹת קֶרֶן וְלֹא חוֹמֶשׁ, וּמִיתָתָן בִּשְׂרֵיפָה.
human_translation: And the Rabbis say: this and that pay the principal and not the one-fifth, and their death by burning,
llm_translation: The sages say: This one and that one pay the principal and not the interest, and their death is by burning.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: אֶת אָבִיהָ – בִּשְׂרֵיפָה, וְאֶת חָמִיהָ – בִּסְקִילָה. מַאי אֶת אָבִיהָ וְאֶת חָמִיהָ?
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: with her father by burning, and with her father-in-law, by stoning. What With her father, and: With her father-in-law?
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: Her father - by burning, and her mother's father - by stoning. What is meant by "her father" and "her mother's father"?

hebrew_text: אִילֵּימָא: אֶת אָבִיהָ – מֵאָבִיהָ, וְאֶת חָמִיהָ – מֵחָמִיהָ, מַאי אִירְיָא בַּת כֹּהֵן? אֲפִילּוּ בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל נָמֵי! בִּתּוֹ – בִּשְׂרֵיפָה, וְכַלָּתוֹ – בִּסְקִילָה.
human_translation: If we say with her father with her father, and with her father-in-law with her father-in-law, why specifically the daughter of a priest? Even the daughter of a non-priest his daughter, by burning, and his daughter-in-law, by stoning.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "Ileima: et avia - meavia, ve'et chamiha - mechamiha, mai irya bat kohen? Afilu bat Yisrael namei! Bitto - bisrefah, ve'chalato - biskilah." English translation: "One might say: 'Her father - from her father, and her father-in-law - from her father-in-law, what is the difference in calling her a daughter of a priest? Even a daughter of Israel also! Her daughter - by burning, and her daughter-in-law - by stoning."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, אֶת אָבִיהָ – בִּרְשׁוּת אָבִיהָ, וְאֶת חָמִיהָ – בִּרְשׁוּת חָמִיהָ.
human_translation: Rather, With her father, under her father’s authority, and With her father-in-law, under her father-in-law’s authority,
llm_translation: Rather, her father's property - in her father's domain, and her husband's property - in her husband's domain.

hebrew_text: כְּמַאן? אִי כְּרַבָּנַן, הָאָמְרִי: נְשׂוּאָה יָצָאת לִשְׂרֵיפָה וְלֹא אֲרוּסָה. אִי כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, הָאָמַר: אַחַת אֲרוּסָה וְאַחַת נְשׂוּאָה בִּשְׂרֵיפָה.
human_translation: In accordance with whose If it is in accordance with the Rabbis, don’t they say married is singled out for burning, but not betrothed? If it is in accordance with Rabbi Shimon, doesn’t he say both the betrothed and the married by burning?
llm_translation: As whom? If like the sages, who said: "A betrothed woman is subject to burning but not a married woman." If like Rabbi Shimon, who said: "One who is betrothed and one who is married are subject to burning."

hebrew_text: וְאִי כְּרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל, הָאָמַר: אֲרוּסָה יָצָאת לִשְׂרֵיפָה, וְלֹא נְשׂוּאָה. אֶת חָמִיהָ – חֶנֶק הוּא!
human_translation: And if it is in accordance with Rabbi Yishmael doesn’t he say betrothed is singled out for burning, but not married? under her father-in-law, is strangulation,
llm_translation: And if according to Rabbi Yishmael, who said: A betrothed woman went out to be burned, but not a married woman. Her mother-in-law - it is strangulation!

hebrew_text: שְׁלַח רָבִין מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: כָּךְ הִיא הַצָּעָה שֶׁל מִשְׁנָה, לְעוֹלָם כְּרַבָּנַן, וְהָכִי קָאָמַר: כֹּל שֶׁהִוא לְמַטָּה מִמִּיתַת אָבִיהָ – וּמַאי נִיהוּ? נְשׂוּאָה בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל. דְּאִילּוּ נְשׂוּאָה בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל בְּחֶנֶק, הָכָא בְּמִיתַת אָבִיהָ בִּשְׂרֵיפָה.
human_translation: Ravin sent in the name of Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina: This is the explanation [ hatza’a ] of mishna, Actually, it is in accordance with the Rabbis. And this is saying: any whose is less than the death for her father, here, in the death of her father, by burning. And what It is the married daughter of a non-priest; as the married daughter of a non-priest by strangulation.
llm_translation: Rabin sent in the name of Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Chanina: This is the suggestion of the Mishnah, always follow the opinion of the Sages, and thus he said: Anyone who is beneath the death of her father - and what is the case? A married daughter of Israel. For if a married daughter of Israel is involved in strangulation, here it is in the death of her father by burning.

hebrew_text: כֹּל שֶׁהִיא לְמַעְלָה מִמִּיתַת אָבִיהָ, וּמַאי נִיהוּ? אֲרוּסָה בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל. דְּאִילּוּ אֲרוּסָה בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל בְּעָלְמָא בִּסְקִילָה, הָכָא בְּמִיתַת חָמִיהָ בִּסְקִילָה.
human_translation: any whose is more than the death for her father, here, in the death of her father-in-law, by stoning. And what is it? the betrothed daughter of a non-priest, as in general, the betrothed daughter of a non-priest by stoning.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Kol shehi lema'alah mimitat avia, u'mai nihu? Arusa bat Yisrael. De'ilu arusa bat Yisrael be'alma bis'kilah, hacha bemitat chamia bis'kilah." English translation: "All that is above the death of her father, and what is it? A betrothed daughter of Israel. For if a betrothed daughter of Israel commits adultery in general, she is punished by stoning, here she is punished by the death of her mother-in-law by stoning."

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה: מִידֵּי ״לְמַעְלָה״ ״לְמַטָּה״ קָתָנֵי? אֶלָּא, אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה:
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya objects to this Does teach more less? Rather, Rabbi Yirmeya says
llm_translation: Rebbe Yirmiyah objects to her: From the terms "above" and "below" does the Mishnah teach? Rather, Rebbe Yirmiyah said:

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם כְּרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל, וְהָכִי קָאָמַר: אֶת אָבִיהָ – בִּרְשׁוּת אָבִיהָ, בִּשְׂרֵיפָה; וְאֶת חָמִיהָ – מֵחָמִיהָ, בִּסְקִילָה; וְכׇל אָדָם – בְּחֶנֶק.
human_translation: Actually, in accordance with Rabbi Yishmael, and this is saying: With her father, under her father’s authority, by burning And With her father-in-law, with her father-in-law, by stoning. And any man by strangulation,
llm_translation: Forever as Rabbi Yishmael, and thus he said: "Her father - with her father's permission, by burning; and her mother's father - from her mother's father's permission, by stoning; and every man - by strangulation."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: מַאי שְׁנָא? אוֹ אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי מַמָּשׁ, אוֹ אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי רְשׁוּת.
human_translation: Rava says: What is different Either this one and that one literally, or this one and that one authority
llm_translation: Rava said: What is the difference? Either both are actual, or both are considered as a mere permission.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: לְעוֹלָם כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, וְקָסָבַר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר נְשׂוּאָה כַּאֲרוּסָה. מָה אֲרוּסָה חַד דַּרְגָּא מַסְּקִינַן לַהּ, מִסְּקִילָה לִשְׂרֵיפָה, אַף נְשׂוּאָה חַד דַּרְגָּא מַסְּקִינַן לַהּ, מֵחֶנֶק לִסְקִילָה.
human_translation: Rather, Rava says: Actually, in accordance with Rabbi Shimon and Rabbi Eliezer holds the married is comparable to the betrothed Just as the betrothed we raise her one level from stoning to burning, so too, the married we raise her one level from strangulation to stoning.
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said: Always follow like Rabbi Shimon, and Rabbi Eliezer holds that a married woman is like an engaged woman. Just as an engaged woman who commits adultery, we first prepare her for stoning, from stoning to burning, so too a married woman who commits adultery, we first prepare her for choking, from choking to stoning.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: הָא אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בִּשְׂרֵיפָה קָאָמַר?
human_translation: Rav Ḥanina objects to this Doesn’t Rabbi Shimon say this and that by burning?
llm_translation: Challenged him Rabbi Chanina: "This one and that one, Rabbi Shimon, are speaking about burning?"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבִינָא: לְעוֹלָם כְּרַבָּנַן, וְאֵיפוֹךְ – אֶת אָבִיהָ בִּסְקִילָה, וְאֶת חָמִיהָ בִּשְׂרֵיפָה. וְהַאי דְּקָאָמַר ״אֶת אָבִיהָ״ – סִירְכָא בְּעָלְמָא נָקֵט.
human_translation: Rather, Ravina says: Actually, in accordance with the Rabbis, And reverse with her father, by stoning, and with her father-in-law, by burning. And that states With her father, he was merely drawn employed
llm_translation: Rather, Ravina said: Always follow the opinion of the Rabbis, and conversely - her father is punished by stoning, and her father-in-law by burning. And what is meant by "her father" - a mere hint.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן, אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ, אָמַר רַב: הֲלָכָה כְּדִשְׁלַח רָבִין מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא. אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: הִלְכְתָא לִמְשִׁיחָא?
human_translation: Rav Naḥman says Rabba bar Avuh says Rav says: halakha is in accordance with that Ravin sent in the name of Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina. Rav Yosef said a halakha for the messianic
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said, Rabba bar Avuh said, Rav said: The halakha is in accordance with the opinion of Rabbi Yosei, the son of Rabbi Chanina. Rav Yosef said: Is this a halakha for the Messiah?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, שְׁחִיטַת קֳדָשִׁים לָא לִיתְנֵי? הִלְכְתָא לִמְשִׁיחָא! אֶלָּא, דְּרוֹשׁ וְקַבֵּל שָׂכָר. הָכָא נָמֵי, דְּרוֹשׁ וְקַבֵּל שָׂכָר.
human_translation: Abaye said to him: If that is so, let not teach the slaughter of sacrificial it is a halakha for the messianic Rather, Study and receive reward, Here too, study and receive reward.
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: Rather from now on, the slaughtering of holy offerings is not given? It is a halacha for the anointed one! Rather, inquire and receive reward. Here too, inquire and receive reward.

hebrew_text: הָכִי קָאָמְרִי: הִלְכְתָא לְמָה לִי? סוּגְיָא דִּשְׁמַעְתָּא הֲלָכָה קָאָמַר.
human_translation: This is what I say: Why do I the halakha Is a halakha stated the discussion of statement?
llm_translation: So they say: Why do I need this law? It is a support for what you have heard; it is stating a halakha.

hebrew_text: מַאי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל? דְּתַנְיָא: ״וּבַת [אִישׁ] כֹּהֵן כִּי תֵחֵל לִזְנוֹת״ – בְּנַעֲרָה וְהִיא אֲרוּסָה הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר.
human_translation: What Rabbi Yishmael? as it is taught “And the daughter of a priest, when she profanes herself by playing the harlot” the verse is speaking of a young woman who is betrothed.
llm_translation: What is the opinion of Rabbi Yishmael? For it was taught: "And the daughter of a Kohen who begins to commit harlotry" - when she is a young girl and she is engaged, the Scripture speaks.

hebrew_text: אַתָּה אוֹמֵר בְּנַעֲרָה וְהִיא אֲרוּסָה, אוֹ אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ נְשׂוּאָה? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אִישׁ אֲשֶׁר יִנְאַף אֶת אֵשֶׁת רֵעֵהוּ מוֹת יוּמַת הַנֹּאֵף וְהַנֹּאָפֶת״. הַכֹּל הָיוּ בִּכְלַל ״הַנּוֹאֵף וְהַנּוֹאֶפֶת״. הוֹצִיא הַכָּתוּב בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל בִּסְקִילָה וּבַת כֹּהֵן בִּשְׂרֵיפָה. מָה כְּשֶׁהוֹצִיא הַכָּתוּב אֶת בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל לִסְקִילָה – אֲרוּסָה וְלֹא נְשׂוּאָה, אַף כְּשֶׁהוֹצִיא הַכָּתוּב בַּת כֹּהֵן לִשְׂרֵיפָה – אֲרוּסָה וְלֹא נְשׂוּאָה.
human_translation: Do you say to a young woman who is betrothed, or it is even a married woman?
