The verse states: a man who commits adultery with his neighbor’s wife, both the adulterer and the adulteress shall be put to death” All were included in “The adulterer and the adulteress,” the verse singled out the daughter of a non-priest by stoning and the daughter of a priest by burning. just as when the verse singles out the daughter of a non-priest for stoning betrothed and not married, so too, when the verse singles out the daughter of a priest for burning betrothed and not married.
llm_translation: You say with regard to a betrothed maiden, is it specifically when she is betrothed, or even if she is married? The Torah teaches: "The man who commits adultery with another man's wife, the adulterer and the adulteress shall surely be put to death." All are included in the category of "the adulterer and the adulteress." The Scripture singled out the daughter of Israel for stoning and the daughter of a Kohen for burning. Just as when the Scripture singled out the daughter of Israel for stoning – she is considered betrothed and not married, so too when the Scripture singled out the daughter of a Kohen for burning – she is considered betrothed and not married.

hebrew_text: זוֹמְמֶיהָ וּבוֹעֲלָהּ בִּכְלַל ״וַעֲשִׂיתֶם לוֹ כַּאֲשֶׁר זָמַם וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: The conspiring witnesses and paramour of are included in “And you shall do to him as he conspired
llm_translation: Her plotters and her seducers included "And you shall do to him as he plotted etc."

hebrew_text: בּוֹעֲלָהּ – מַאי ״כַּאֲשֶׁר זָמַם״ אִיכָּא? אֶלָּא: זוֹמְמֶיהָ בִּכְלַל מִיתַת בּוֹעֲלָהּ.
human_translation: What is there “as he conspired” her paramour? Rather, Her conspiring witnesses are included in the death of her paramour,
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "Bo'alah - what is 'as he schemed' (k'asher zamam) there? Rather: scheming in general is included in the death penalty for Bo'alah."

hebrew_text: מִשּׁוּם שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַעֲשִׂיתֶם לוֹ כַּאֲשֶׁר זָמַם לַעֲשׂוֹת לְאָחִיו״, וְלֹא לַאֲחוֹתוֹ. דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל.
human_translation: because it is stated: “And you shall do to him as he conspired to do to his brother,” but not to his sister. the statement of Rabbi Yishmael.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Because it is stated: "And you shall do to him as he plotted to do to his brother," and not to his sister. These are the words of Rabbi Yishmael.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: אַחַת אֲרוּסָה וְאַחַת נְשׂוּאָה יָצָאת לִשְׂרֵיפָה. יָכוֹל אֲפִילּוּ פְּנוּיָה? נֶאֱמַר כָּאן ״אָבִיהָ״, וְנֶאֱמַר לְהַלָּן ״אָבִיהָ״. מָה לְהַלָּן זְנוּת עִם זִיקַת הַבַּעַל, אַף כָּאן זְנוּת עִם זִיקַת הַבַּעַל.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: Both the betrothed and the married are singled out for burning. might even an unmarried here it is stated: “Her father,” and there it is stated, “Her father” just as below, promiscuous intercourse a bond to a husband, so too here, promiscuous intercourse a bond to a husband.
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: One who is betrothed and one who is married are both liable to burning. Can this even apply to one who is single? It is stated here "her father," and it is stated elsewhere "her father." Just as there it refers to illicit relations with a married man, so too here it refers to illicit relations with a married man.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: אִי, מָה לְהַלָּן נַעֲרָה וְהִיא אֲרוּסָה, אַף כָּאן נַעֲרָה וְהִיא אֲרוּסָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yishmael said to him: If just as there a young woman who is betrothed, so too here, a young woman who is betrothed.
llm_translation: He said to him Rabbi Yishmael: If, what there a young woman and she betrothed, also here a young woman and she betrothed.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: יִשְׁמָעֵאל אָחִי, ״בַּת״ ״וּבַת״ אֲנִי דּוֹרֵשׁ.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva said to him: Yishmael, my brother, I derive “The daughter “And the daughter
llm_translation: He said to him Rabbi Akiva: Yishmael my brother, "daughter" and "granddaughter" I am interpreting.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ: וְכִי מִפְּנֵי שֶׁאַתָּה דּוֹרֵשׁ ״בַּת״ ״וּבַת״ נוֹצִיא זוֹ לִשְׂרֵיפָה? אִם מַשְׁמַע לְהָבִיא אֶת הַנְּשׂוּאָה, הָבֵיא אֶת הַפְּנוּיָה; וְאִם מַשְׁמַע לְהוֹצִיא אֶת הַפְּנוּיָה, הוֹצֵיא אֶת הַנְּשׂוּאָה.
human_translation: said to him: And because you derive “the daughter” “and the daughter,” we should take this out to burning? if indicates the inclusion of the married include the unmarried And if it indicates the exclusion of an unmarried one, exclude the married
llm_translation: He said to him: "Just because you interpret 'daughter' and 'and daughter' to exclude this one for burning? If you understand to bring the married woman, bring the unmarried woman; and if you understand to exclude the unmarried woman, exclude the married woman."

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, אַהֲנִי גְּזֵירָה שָׁוָה לְמַעוֹטֵי פְּנוּיָה, וְאַהֲנִי ״בַּת״ ״וּבַת״ לְרַבּוֹת אֶת הַנְּשׂוּאָה.
human_translation: And Rabbi Akiva verbal analogy serves to exclude an unmarried and “the daughter” “and the daughter” serves to include the a married woman.
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva said: "This decree is similar to the case of 'ma'otei p'nuyah,' and 'bat' and 'uvat' are inclusive to expand the category of married women."

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל סָבַר: מִדְּקָאָמַר לֵיהּ ״בַּת״ ״וּבַת״, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ הֲדַר בֵּיהּ מִגְּזֵירָה שָׁוָה.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yishmael thought since said to him “the daughter” “and the daughter,” conclude from it retracted from the verbal analogy,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yishmael holds: From the fact that it says "daughter" and "and daughter," learn from it that he should return to her from the decree that is equal.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל, הַאי ״בַּת״ ״וּבַת״ מַאי דָּרֵישׁ בֵּיהּ? מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְכִדְתָנֵי אֲבוּהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל בַּר אָבִין: לְפִי שֶׁמָּצִינוּ שֶׁחִלֵּק הַכָּתוּב בִּזְכָרִים בֵּין תְּמִימִים לְבַעֲלֵי מוּמִין, יָכוֹל נַחְלוֹק בִּבְנוֹתֵיהֶן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״בַּת״ ״וּבַת״.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yishmael, what does he derive from this “the daughter” “and the daughter”? He requires it for that which the father of Shmuel bar Avin taught Since we find that the verse differentiates with regard to male between unblemished and blemished might we should differentiate between their daughters “The daughter,” the verse states: “And the daughter,”
llm_translation: Rabbi Yishmael: What does the term "daughter" and "granddaughter" come to teach us? He sought to derive from it as it was taught in the house of Shmuel bar Avin: Since we find that the Scripture distinguishes between males, between the unblemished and the blemished, can it also distinguish between their daughters? The Scripture states: "daughter" and "granddaughter."

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא מִן ״הֵם מַקְרִיבִם וְהָיוּ קֹדֶשׁ״ נָפְקָא.
human_translation: And Rabbi Akiva from they offer; and they shall be holy” it is derived
llm_translation: And Rabbi Akiva from "He brings them near and they shall be holy" derived.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל, אִי מֵהַהִיא הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: הָנֵי מִילֵּי אִינְהוּ, אֲבָל בְּנוֹתֵיהֶן לָא. קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yishmael If from that I would say this matter themselves, but not their daughters. teaches us
llm_translation: Rabbi Yishmael, if from that statement I would say: those words they are, but their daughters no. It is heard to us.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל,
human_translation: And Rabbi Yishmael,
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yishmael,

hebrew_text: הַאי ״אָבִיהָ הִיא מְחַלֶּלֶת״, מַאי דָּרֵישׁ בֵּיהּ?
human_translation: what does he derive from this “She profanes her father”
llm_translation: This "her father, she desecrates," what is the interpretation in it?

hebrew_text: מִבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְכִדְתַנְיָא: הָיָה רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר, מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״אֶת אָבִיהָ הִיא מְחַלֶּלֶת״? שֶׁאִם הָיוּ נוֹהֲגִין בּוֹ קוֹדֶשׁ – נוֹהֲגִין בּוֹ חוֹל, כָּבוֹד – נוֹהֲגִין בּוֹ בִּזָּיוֹן. אוֹמְרִין: ״אָרוּר שֶׁזּוֹ יָלַד, אָרוּר שֶׁזּוֹ גִּידֵּל, אָרוּר שֶׁיָּצָא זוֹ מֵחֲלָצָיו״.
human_translation: requires it for that which is taught Rabbi Meir would say: Why the verse state: “She profanes her father”? that if they would treat a sacred they treat him a profane honor, treat him degradation. They say: Cursed who bore this cursed who raised this cursed from whose loins this emerged.
llm_translation: He sought to reconcile it according to the teaching: Rabbi Meir used to say, what does the Scripture mean by "she profanes her father"? That if they were accustomed to treat him with sanctity, they treat him with disrespect; with honor, they treat him with contempt. They say, "Cursed be she who gave birth, cursed be she who raised, cursed be she who brought forth from his loins."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: כְּמַאן קָרֵינַן ״רַשִּׁיעָא בַּר רַשִּׁיעָא״, וַאֲפִילּוּ לְרַשִּׁיעָא בַּר צַדִּיקָא, כְּמַאן? כְּהַאי תַּנָּא.
human_translation: Rav Ashi says: In accordance with whose do we call even a wicked person the son of a righteous person: A wicked person, the son of a wicked person? In accordance with whose is in accordance with this tanna ,
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said: In whose name do we read "Rashiya bar Rashiya"? Even for Rashiya bar Tzadika, in whose name? Like this Tanna.

hebrew_text: זוֹ מִצְוַת הַנִּסְקָלִין. מַאי תַּנָּא דְּקָתָנֵי זוֹ מִצְוַת הַנִּסְקָלִין?
human_translation: This the mitzva of those who are stoned, What taught which it teaches This the mitzva of those who are stoned?
llm_translation: This is the commandment of stoning. What is the opinion of the Tanna who teaches "This is the commandment of stoning"?

hebrew_text: מִשּׁוּם דִּתְנָא: נִגְמַר הַדִּין מוֹצִיאִין אוֹתוֹ לְסׇקְלוֹ. בֵּית הַסְּקִילָה הָיָה גָּבוֹהַּ שְׁתֵּי קוֹמוֹת. וְאַיְּידֵי דְּקָא בָעֵי לְמִיתְנֵא מִצְוַת הַנִּשְׂרָפִין, תְּנָא נָמֵי זוֹ מִצְוַת הַנִּסְקָלִין.
human_translation: because it teaches the trial has ended he is taken out to be stoned. The place of stoning is twice the height And since wants to teach The mitzva of those who are burned, it also teaches This the mitzva of those who are stoned,
llm_translation: From a teaching: once the judgment is complete, they take him out to stone him. The height of the stoning place was two stories. And since he requires fulfilling the commandment of those who are burned, a teaching also states that this fulfills the commandment of those who are stoned.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מִצְוַת הַנִּשְׂרָפִין – הָיוּ מְשַׁקְּעִין אוֹתוֹ בַּזֶּבֶל עַד אַרְכוּבּוֹתָיו, וְנוֹתְנִין סוּדָר קָשָׁה לְתוֹךְ הָרַכָּה, וְכוֹרֵךְ עַל צַוָּארוֹ. זֶה מוֹשֵׁךְ אֶצְלוֹ וְזֶה מוֹשֵׁךְ אֶצְלוֹ, עַד שֶׁפּוֹתֵחַ אֶת פִּיו. וּמַדְלִיק אֶת הַפְּתִילָה וְזוֹרְקָהּ לְתוֹךְ פִּיו, וְיוֹרֶדֶת לְתוֹךְ מֵעָיו וְחוֹמֶרֶת אֶת בְּנֵי מֵעָיו.
human_translation: The mitzva of those who are burned, submerge in dung up to his knees and they place a rough scarf within a soft one, and wrap around his neck. This pulls toward himself, and that pulls toward himself, until open his mouth, And lights the wick and throws it into his mouth, and it goes down into his intestines and burns his intestines
llm_translation: It was taught: The commandment of burning the red heifer - they would immerse it in dung up to its eyebrows, and place a hard saddle within the soft flesh, and tie it around its neck. This one pulls it this way, and that one pulls it that way, until it opens its mouth. And he lights the wick and throws it into its mouth, and it descends into its intestines and burns the offspring of its intestines.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אַף הוּא, אִם מֵת בְּיָדָם – לֹא הָיוּ מְקַיְּימִין בּוֹ מִצְוַת שְׂרֵיפָה, אֶלָּא פּוֹתֵחַ אֶת פִּיו בִּצְבָת שֶׁלֹּא בְּטוֹבָתוֹ, וּמַדְלִיק אֶת הַפְּתִילָה וְזוֹרְקָהּ לְתוֹךְ פִּיו, וְיוֹרֶדֶת לְתוֹךְ מֵעָיו וְחוֹמֶרֶת אֶת בְּנֵי מֵעָיו.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: But if this died at their hands they have not fulfilled the mitzva of burning for Rather, opens the mouth of with prongs, against his will, and lights the wick and throws it into his mouth, and it goes down into his intestines and burns his intestines
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: Even he, if he died by their hands - they did not fulfill in him the commandment of burning, but he opens his mouth with a spit not for his benefit, and lights the wick and throws it into his mouth, and it descends into his intestines and burns his intestines.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן צָדוֹק: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּבַת כֹּהֵן אַחַת שֶׁזִּינְּתָה, וְהִקִּיפוּהָ חֲבִילֵי זְמוֹרוֹת וּשְׂרָפוּהָ. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: מִפְּנֵי שֶׁלֹּא הָיָה בֵּית דִּין שֶׁל אוֹתָהּ שָׁעָה בָּקִי.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar ben Tzadok said: An incident with regard to a certain priest’s daughter who committed adultery, and they wrapped her in bundles of branches and burned her, said to him: because the court at that time was not proficient
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar ben Tzadok said: There was an incident with a certain daughter of a priest who committed adultery, and they surrounded her with bundles of branches and burned her. They said to him: Because the court at that time was not proficient.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי פְּתִילָה? אָמַר רַב מַתְנָה: פְּתִילָה שֶׁל אֲבָר.
human_translation: What wick Rav Mattana says: A wick of lead,
llm_translation: Gemara: What is "petilah"? Rav Matnah said: "Petilah" is a string of a fetus.

hebrew_text: מְנָא לַן? אָתְיָא ״שְׂרֵיפָה״ ״שְׂרֵיפָה״ מֵעֲדַת קֹרַח. מָה לְהַלָּן שְׂרֵיפַת נְשָׁמָה וְגוּף קַיָּים, אַף כָּאן שְׂרֵיפַת נְשָׁמָה וְגוּף קַיָּים.
human_translation: From where do we It is derived from burning burning the assembly of Korah, Just as there, the burning of soul but body intact, so too here, the burning soul, but body intact.
llm_translation: We ask: It was taught, "Burning," "burning" from the congregation of Korah. Just as there, the burning of the soul and the body remains, so too here, the burning of the soul and the body remains.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אָמַר: אָתְיָא שְׂרֵיפָה שְׂרֵיפָה מִבְּנֵי אַהֲרֹן, מָה לְהַלָּן שְׂרֵיפַת נְשָׁמָה וְגוּף קַיָּים – אַף כָּאן שְׂרֵיפַת נְשָׁמָה וְגוּף קַיָּים.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar says derived from burning burning the sons of Aaron Just as there, the burning of soul, but body intact, so too here, the burning of soul, but body intact.
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: It is derived, burning, burning, from the sons of Aaron, just as there, the burning of the soul and the body are sustained - so too here, the burning of the soul and the body are sustained.

hebrew_text: מַאן דְּיָלֵיף מֵעֲדַת קֹרַח, מְנָא לֵיהּ? דִּכְתִיב: ״וְאֵת מַחְתּוֹת הַחַטָּאִים הָאֵלֶּה בְּנַפְשֹׁתָם״, שֶׁנִּשְׁמָתָן נִשְׂרֶפֶת וְגוּף קַיָּים.
human_translation: From where does the one who derives from the assembly of Korah which is written: “And the firepans of these men who have sinned with their souls” that their souls were burned, but bodies were intact.
llm_translation: One who separates from the congregation of Korah, where is he from? As it is written: "And these sinners' censers, with their lives," meaning their souls are burnt but their bodies remain.

hebrew_text: וְאִידַּךְ: הָהִיא שְׂרֵיפָה מַמָּשׁ הִיא. וּמַאי ״בְּנַפְשֹׁתָם״? שֶׁנִּתְחַיְּיבוּ שְׂרֵיפָה עַל עִסְקֵי נַפְשׁוֹתָם.
human_translation: And the other That was actual burning And what “With their souls”? that they were deemed liable burning due to matters of their souls,
llm_translation: And the other opinion: that burning is actual burning. And what is "with their lives"? That they are liable to burning for matters of their lives.

hebrew_text: כִּדְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ, דְּאָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: מַאי דִּכְתִיב ״בְּחַנְפֵי לַעֲגֵי מָעוֹג חָרֹק עָלַי שִׁנֵּימוֹ״? בִּשְׁבִיל חֲנוּפָּה שֶׁהֶחְנִיפוּ לְקֹרַח עַל עִסְקֵי לְגִימָה, חָרַק עֲלֵיהֶן שַׂר שֶׁל גֵּיהִנָּם שִׁנָּיו.
human_translation: in accordance with of Reish Lakish. As Reish Lakish says: What which is written: “With the flattering mockeries of spitefulness [ maog ] they gnash at me with their teeth” because of the flattery who flattered Korah over matters of eating, the minister of Gehenna gnashed his teeth over them,
llm_translation: As Reish Lakish expounded, for Reish Lakish said: What is the meaning of the verse, "In the taunts of the mockers of the cake, fire consumed my teeth"? Because of the flattery with which they flattered Korah regarding matters of division, the prince of Gehenna sharpened his teeth against them.

hebrew_text: וּמַאן דְּיָלֵיף מִבְּנֵי אַהֲרֹן מְנָא לֵיהּ? דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיָּמֻתוּ לִפְנֵי ה׳״, כְּעֵין מִיתָה.
human_translation: And from where does the one who derives from the sons of Aaron which is written: and they died before the Lord” similar to death,
llm_translation: One who is descended from the sons of Aaron, how is he distinguished? As it is written: "And they died before the Lord," similar to death.

hebrew_text: וְאִידַּךְ: הָהוּא שְׂרֵיפָה מַמָּשׁ הֲוַאי. וּמַאי דִּכְתִיב ״וַיָּמֻתוּ״? דְּאַתְחֵיל בְּהוּ מִגַּוַּאי, כְּעֵין מִיתָה. דְּתַנְיָא, אַבָּא יוֹסֵי בֶּן דּוֹסְתַּאי אוֹמֵר: שְׁנֵי חוּטִין שֶׁל אֵשׁ יָצְאוּ מִבֵּית קוֹדֶשׁ הַקֳּדָשִׁים וְנֶחְלְקוּ לְאַרְבַּע, וְנִכְנְסוּ שְׁנַיִם בְּחוֹטְמוֹ שֶׁל זֶה וּשְׁנַיִם בְּחוֹטְמוֹ שֶׁל זֶה וּשְׂרָפוּם.
human_translation: And the other That was actual burning. And what which is written: “And they died”? that started from within them, similar to death, As it is taught Abba Yosei ben Dostai says: Two threads of fire came out of the Holy of Holies and split into four, and two entered the nostrils of this and two the nostrils of that and burned them.
llm_translation: And the other opinion: that burning was literal. And what is the meaning of "and they died"? That it began with them from the inside, like a form of death. As it was taught: Abba Yosei ben Dosatai says: Two threads of fire emerged from the Holy of Holies and divided into four, and two entered the wick of this one and two entered the wick of that one, and they burned them.

hebrew_text: וְהָכְתִיב: ״וַתֹּאכַל אוֹתָם״! אוֹתָם, וְלֹא בִּגְדֵיהֶם.
human_translation: But isn’t it written: “And devoured them [ vatokhal otam ]”? “them,” but not their clothes.
llm_translation: And it is written: "And she ate them"! Them, and not their garments.

hebrew_text: וְנֵילַף מִפָּרִים הַנִּשְׂרָפִים, מָה לְהַלָּן שְׂרֵיפָה מַמָּשׁ – אַף כָּאן שְׂרֵיפָה מַמָּשׁ?
human_translation: And let us derive from bull that are burned. Just as there, actual burning, so too here, actual burning.
llm_translation: And we derive a comparison from the burning of the bulls, what is the law there regarding actual burning - so too here is the law regarding actual burning?

hebrew_text: מִסְתַּבְּרָא מֵאָדָם הֲוָה לֵיהּ לְמֵילַף, שֶׁכֵּן אָדָם, חוֹטֵא, נְשָׁמָה, פִּיגּוּל.
human_translation: It stands to reason one should derive from a person, as a person, a sinner, a soul an offering that was sacrificed with the intent to consume it after its designated time [ piggul ],
llm_translation: He was created from Adam, he had to be circumcised, for so is man, a sinner, a soul, a carcass.

hebrew_text: אַדְּרַבָּה, מִפָּרִים הַנִּשְׂרָפִים הֲוָה לֵיהּ לְמֵילַף, שֶׁכֵּן מַכְשִׁיר לְדוֹרוֹת.
human_translation: On the contrary, one should derive from bull that are burned, as enable for generations,
llm_translation: אַדְּרַבָּה, מִפָּרִים הַנִּשְׂרָפִים הֲוָה לֵיהּ לְמֵילַף, שֶׁכֵּן מַכְשִׁיר לְדוֹרוֹת. Ad'Rabba, from burnt bulls was for him to teach, for thus it is effective for generations.

hebrew_text: הָנָךְ נְפִישִׁין.
human_translation: Those are more numerous
llm_translation: Here is the English translation: "The souls are resting."

hebrew_text: מַאן דְּיָלֵיף מֵעֲדַת קֹרַח, מַאי טַעְמָא לָא יָלֵיף מִבְּנֵי אַהֲרֹן? הָהוּא שְׂרֵיפָה מַמָּשׁ הֲוַאי. וְנֵילַף מִינַּהּ?
human_translation: the one who derives from the assembly of Korah, what is the reason he does not derive from the sons of Aaron? that was actual burning. But let us derive from
llm_translation: One who separates from the congregation of Korah, what is the reason he does not separate from the sons of Aaron? That fire itself is the reason. And what is separated from it?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ: אָמַר קְרָא ״וְאָהַבְתָּ לְרֵעֲךָ כָּמוֹךָ״, בְּרוֹר לוֹ מִיתָה יָפָה.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman says Rabba bar Avuh says: verse states: “And you shall love your neighbor as yourself” select a good, death for him.
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said, Rabba bar Avuh said: The verse states, "You shall love your neighbor as yourself," clarify for him a pleasant death.

hebrew_text: וְכִי מֵאַחַר דְּאִיכָּא דְּרַב נַחְמָן, גְּזֵירָה שָׁוָה לְמָה לִי?
human_translation: And since there is of Rav Naḥman, why do I verbal analogy?
llm_translation: And when there is a case of Rav Nachman, why do I need a similar decree?

hebrew_text: אִי לָאו גְּזֵירָה שָׁוָה, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: שְׂרֵיפַת נְשָׁמָה וְגוּף קַיָּים – לָאו שְׂרֵיפָה הִיא כְּלָל. וְאִי מִשּׁוּם ״וְאָהַבְתָּ לְרֵעֲךָ כָּמוֹךָ״, לַפֵּישׁ לֵיהּ חֲבִילֵי זְמוֹרוֹת כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלִישְׂרוֹף לַעֲגַל. קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: Were it not verbal analogy, I would say the burning of soul, but body intact, is not burning at all, And if due to “And you shall love your neighbor as yourself” (Leviticus 19:18), let increase for him the bundles of branches, so that he will burn quicker. teaches us
llm_translation: If it is not a decree, it would be logical to say: "The burning of the soul and the body remains - is not burning in general." And if it is due to "Love your neighbor as yourself," then let him carry bundles of branches so that the calf will not burn. This is what we have heard.

hebrew_text: וּכְבָר הָיוּ מֹשֶׁה וְאַהֲרֹן מְהַלְּכִין בַּדֶּרֶךְ, וְנָדָב וַאֲבִיהוּא מְהַלְּכִין אַחֲרֵיהֶן, וְכׇל יִשְׂרָאֵל אַחֲרֵיהֶן. אָמַר לוֹ נָדָב לַאֲבִיהוּא: אֵימָתַי יָמוּתוּ שְׁנֵי זְקֵנִים הַלָּלוּ וַאֲנִי וְאַתָּה נַנְהִיג אֶת הַדּוֹר? אָמַר לָהֶן הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: הֲנִרְאֶה מִי קוֹבֵר אֶת מִי. אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא, הַיְינוּ דְּאָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי: נְפִישֵׁי גַּמְלֵי סָבֵי דִּטְעִינִי מַשְׁכֵי דְהוּגְנֵי.
human_translation: And already Moses and Aaron were walking on way, and Nadav and Avihu were walking behind them, and the entire Jewish people behind them. Nadav said to Avihu: When will these two old men will die and you and I will lead the generation, The Holy One, Blessed be He, said to them: We shall see who buries whom. Rav Pappa says: This that people say: Many are the old camels that are loaded with the skins of young camels.
llm_translation: Moses and Aaron were walking on the road, and Nadab and Abihu were walking behind them, and all of Israel behind them. Nadab said to Abihu: When will these two elders die, and you and I will lead the generation? The Holy One, blessed be He, said to them: It is revealed who will bury whom. Rav Papa said: This is like what people say, "The strong will bury the weak."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר:
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says:
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Eliezer:

hebrew_text: לְמָה תַּלְמִיד חָכָם דּוֹמֶה לִפְנֵי עַם הָאָרֶץ? בַּתְּחִלָּה, דּוֹמֶה לְקִיתוֹן שֶׁל זָהָב. סִיפֵּר הֵימֶנּוּ, דּוֹמֶה לְקִיתוֹן שֶׁל כֶּסֶף. נֶהֱנָה מִמֶּנּוּ, דּוֹמֶה לְקִיתוֹן שֶׁל חֶרֶשׂ. כֵּיוָן שֶׁנִּשְׁבַּר, שׁוּב אֵין לוֹ תַּקָּנָה.
human_translation: To what is a Torah scholar compared before an ignoramus? At first, like a goblet [ lekiton ] of gold. he has conversed with him like a goblet of silver, has received benefit from he like an earthenware goblet, once broken cannot be fixed.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Why is a Torah scholar compared to a golden cask? Initially, compared to a golden cask. He narrated from it, compared to a silver cask. He benefits from it, compared to an earthenware cask. Once it breaks, he no longer has any remedy.

hebrew_text: אִימַּרְתָּא בַּת טָלֵי, בַּת כֹּהֵן שֶׁזִּינְּתָה הֲוַאי. אַקְּפַהּ (רַב) חָמָא בַּר טוֹבִיָּה חֲבִילֵי זְמוֹרוֹת וְשַׂרְפַהּ.
human_translation: Imrata bat Talei was a priest’s daughter who committed adultery. Rav Ḥama bar Toviyya surrounded her bundles of branches and burned her.
llm_translation: The saying of Bat Talay, daughter of a priest who committed adultery. Rav Hama son of Toviya wrapped her in bundles of branches and burned her.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: טְעָה בְּתַרְתֵּי, טְעָה בִּדְרַב מַתְנָה, וּטְעָה בִּדְתַנְיָא. ״וּבָאתָ אֶל הַכֹּהֲנִים הַלְוִיִּם וְאֶל הַשֹּׁפֵט אֲשֶׁר יִהְיֶה בַּיָּמִים הָהֵם״ – בִּזְמַן שֶׁיֵּשׁ כֹּהֵן יֵשׁ מִשְׁפָּט, בִּזְמַן שֶׁאֵין כֹּהֵן אֵין מִשְׁפָּט.
human_translation: Rav Yosef says: erred with regard to two He erred with regard to of Rav Mattana, and he erred with regard to that which is taught “And you shall come to the priests, the Levites, and to the judge that will be in those days” at a time when there is a priest there is judgment at a time when there is no priest, there is no judgment
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: He erred in two, erred in Rav Matna, and erred in the Tannaitic teaching. "And you shall come to the priests, the Levites, and to the judge who will be in those days" - when there is a priest there is judgment, when there is no priest there is no judgment.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי צָדוֹק: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּבַת כֹּהֵן שֶׁזִּינְּתָה וְכוּ׳. אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: בֵּית דִּין שֶׁל צַדּוּקִים הֲוָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Tzadok, said: An incident with regard to a priest’s daughter who committed adultery, Rav Yosef says: It was a court of the Sadducees,
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Tzadok, said: There was an incident with the daughter of a priest who engaged in promiscuous behavior, etc. Rabbi Yosef said: It was a court of Sadducees.

hebrew_text: הָכִי אֲמַר לְהוּ, וְהָכִי אַהְדַּרוּ לֵיהּ? וְהָתַנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי צָדוֹק: זְכוּרַנִי כְּשֶׁהָיִיתִי תִּינוֹק וּמוּרְכָּב עַל כְּתֵיפוֹ שֶׁל אַבָּא, וְהֵבִיאוּ בַּת כֹּהֵן שֶׁזִּינְּתָה וְהִקִּיפוּהָ חֲבִילֵי זְמוֹרוֹת וּשְׂרָפוּהָ. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: קָטָן הָיִיתָ, וְאֵין מְבִיאִין רְאָיָה מִן הַקָּטָן. שְׁנֵי מַעֲשִׂים הֲווֹ.
human_translation: Did say that to and did answer him in that manner? But isn’t taught Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Tzadok, says: I remember when I was a child, and was riding on father’s shoulders. And they brought a priest’s daughter who had committed adultery, and surrounded her bundles of branches and burned her. said to him: You were a minor and one cannot bring proof from a minor, There were two incidents,
llm_translation: So he said to them, "And thus did they respond to him?" And it was taught: Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Tzadok, said: "Remember me when I was a child and riding on my father's shoulders, and they brought a daughter of a priest who had committed adultery, and they surrounded her with bundles of myrtle branches and burned her." They said to him: "You were a minor, and we do not bring evidence from a minor. There were two incidents."

hebrew_text: הֵי אֲמַר לְהוּ בְּרֵישָׁא? אִילֵימָא הָא קַמַּיְיתָא אֲמַר לְהוּ בְּרֵישָׁא, אֲמַר לֵיהּ כְּשֶׁהוּא גָּדוֹל, וְלָא אַשְׁגַּחוּ בֵּיהּ. אֲמַר לְהוּ כְּשֶׁהוּא קָטָן, וְאַשְׁגַּחוּ בֵּיהּ?
human_translation: Which did he tell first? If we say first he told them this first told when he was an adult, and they paid no attention to him, would he tell when he was a small child and they would pay attention to him?
llm_translation: "If he said it at the beginning? Perhaps this is what he meant to say at the beginning, he said to him at the beginning, he said to him when he is older, and they did not pay attention to him. He said to him when he is younger, and they pay attention to him?"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, הָא אֲמַר לְהוּ בְּרֵישָׁא, וַאֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: קָטָן הָיִיתָ, וַאֲמַר לְהוּ כְּשֶׁהוּא גָּדוֹל, וַאֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: מִפְּנֵי שֶׁלֹּא הָיָה בֵּית דִּין שֶׁל אוֹתָהּ שָׁעָה בָּקִי.
human_translation: Rather, he first told them that and they said to him: You were a minor, And he told them when he was an adult, and they said to him: because the court at that time was not proficient
llm_translation: Rather, this one said at the beginning, and they said to him: You were a minor, and he said to them when he was an adult, and they said to him: Because the court was not proficient at that time.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מִצְוַת הַנֶּהֱרָגִין הָיוּ מַתִּיזִין אֶת רֹאשׁוֹ בְּסַיִיף, כְּדֶרֶךְ שֶׁהַמַּלְכוּת עוֹשָׂה. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: נִיוּוּל הוּא לוֹ, אֶלָּא מַנִּיחִין אֶת רֹאשׁוֹ עַל הַסַּדָּן וְקוֹצֵץ בְּקוֹפִיץ. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: אֵין מִיתָה מְנוֶּּולֶת מִזּוֹ.
human_translation: The mitzva of those who are killed, cut off his head with a sword, the way that the monarchy does Rabbi Yehuda says: it degrades him. Rather, they place the head of on the block, and chop with a cleaver [ bekofitz ]. said to him: there is no death degrading than that.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: The commandment regarding those who are to be executed was that they would decapitate him with a sword, in the manner that the kingdom does. Rabbi Yehudah says: It is disgraceful for him, rather they place his head on a block and cut with an axe. They said to him: Death is more merciful than this.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תַּנְיָא, אָמַר לָהֶן רַבִּי יְהוּדָה לַחֲכָמִים: אַף אֲנִי יוֹדֵעַ שֶׁמִּיתָה מְנוּוֶּלֶת הִיא, אֲבָל מָה אֶעֱשֶׂה? שֶׁהֲרֵי אָמְרָה תּוֹרָה ״וּבְחֻקֹּתֵיהֶם לֹא תֵלֵכוּ״.
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Yehuda said to the Rabbis: I too, know that it is a degrading death, but what shall I do, as the Torah states: “And you shall not follow their statutes”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemara, tanya, amar lahem Rabbi Yehuda lachachamim: af ani yodea shemita menuvelet hi, aval mah e'eseh? shehrei amra Torah 'uvechukoteihem lo telechu'." English translation: "It was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi Yehuda said to the sages: I also know that she is a menstruating woman, but what shall I do? For the Torah said, 'You shall not approach their laws.'"

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן, כֵּיוָן דִּכְתִיב סַיִיף בְּאוֹרָיְיתָא, לָא מִינַּיְיהוּ קָא גָמְרִינַן.
human_translation: And the Rabbis Since sword is written in the Torah, it is not from we learn
llm_translation: The sages, since it is written "sword" in the Torah, we do not exclude them.

hebrew_text: דְּאִי לָא תֵּימָא הָכִי, הָא דְּתַנְיָא: שׂוֹרְפִין עַל הַמְּלָכִים, וְלֹא מִדַּרְכֵי הָאֱמוֹרִי – הֵיכִי שָׂרְפִינַן? וְהָכְתִיב: ״וּבְחֻקֹּתֵיהֶם לֹא תֵלֵכוּ״! אֶלָּא, כֵּיוָן דִּכְתִיב שְׂרֵיפָה בְּאוֹרָיְיתָא, דִּכְתִיב: ״וּבְמִשְׂרְפוֹת אֲבוֹתֶיךָ וְגוֹ׳״, לָאו מִינַּיְיהוּ קָא גָמְרִינַן. וְהָכָא נָמֵי, כֵּיוָן דִּכְתִיב סַיִיף בְּאוֹרָיְיתָא, לָאו מִינַּיְיהוּ קָא גָמְרִינַן.
human_translation: As, if you do not say so, that which is taught One burns over kings and not for of the ways of the Amorites. How can we perform burning? But isn’t it written: “And you shall not follow their statutes”? Rather, since burning is written in the Torah, as it is written: “And with the burnings of your fathers, not from we learn And here too, since sword is written in the Torah, not from them we learn
llm_translation: If you don't say so, this is what was taught: They burn the bodies for kings, but not in the ways of the Amorites - how do they burn them? And it is written: "Do not follow their statutes"! Rather, since burning is written in the Torah, as it is written: "And in the fires of your fathers, etc.," we do not learn from them. And here too, since a sword is written in the Torah, we do not learn from them.

hebrew_text: וְהָא דִּתְנַן בְּאִידַּךְ פִּירְקִין: אֵלּוּ הֵן הַנֶּהֱרָגִין: הָרוֹצֵחַ, וְאַנְשֵׁי עִיר הַנִּדַּחַת. בִּשְׁלָמָא עִיר הַנִּדַּחַת – כְּתִיב בְּהוּ ״לְפִי חָרֶב״, אֶלָּא רוֹצֵחַ – מְנָלַן?
human_translation: And that which we learned in another chapter These are those who are killed The murderer and the people of an idolatrous city, Granted, an idolatrous city it is written concerning them: with the edge of the sword” But a murderer, from where do we
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And this that we learned in the other chapter: These are the ones who are killed: the murderer, and the people of the city of refuge. The people of the city of refuge, it is understandable – it is written regarding them "by the sword," but the murderer – from where do we derive?

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: ״נָקֹם יִנָּקֵם״ – נְקִימָה זוֹ אֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ מָה הִיא. כְּשֶׁהוּא אוֹמֵר: ״וְהֵבֵאתִי עֲלֵיכֶם חֶרֶב נֹקֶמֶת נְקַם בְּרִית״, הֱוֵי אוֹמֵר: נְקִימָה זוֹ סַיִיף.
human_translation: as it is taught he shall be avenged” I do not know what this vengeance is When it says: “And I will bring upon you the sword avenging the vengeance of the covenant” you must say vengeance is sword.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: "Vengeance is Mine, I will repay" - I do not know what this means. When it says, "And I will bring a sword upon you that will execute the vengeance of the covenant," one should say: Vengeance is a sword.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא: דְּבָרֵיז לֵיהּ מִיבְרָז? ״לְפִי חָרֶב״ כְּתִיב!
human_translation: But say that should stab him It is written “With the edge of the sword,”
llm_translation: And why not say: "His words to him from the sword?" It is written: "By the sword"!

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא דְּעָבֵיד לֵיהּ גִּיסְטְרָא? אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ: אָמַר קְרָא ״וְאָהַבְתָּ לְרֵעֲךָ כָּמוֹךָ״, בְּרוֹר לוֹ מִיתָה יָפָה.
human_translation: But say that should cut him in half [ gistera ], Rav Naḥman says Rabba bar Avuh says: verse states: “And you shall love your neighbor as yourself” select a good, death for him.
llm_translation: And why does he need to do him a favor? Rav Nachman said, Rabba bar Avuh said: The verse says, "You shall love your neighbor as yourself," choose for him a good death.

hebrew_text: אַשְׁכְּחַן דִּקְטַל עַבְדָּא, בַּר חוֹרִין מְנָא לַן?
human_translation: We have found who killed slave from where do we a freeman
llm_translation: We have found that a slave was killed, the son of a free man, what is the law for us?

hebrew_text: וְלָאו קַל וָחוֹמֶר הוּא: קְטַל עַבְדָּא בְּסַיִיף, בַּר חוֹרִין בְּחֶנֶק?
human_translation: But is it not a fortiori ? killed slave by sword, a freeman by strangulation?
llm_translation: And it is not a fortiori argument: If one kills a slave with a sword, is a free man liable for strangulation?

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר: חֶנֶק קַל, אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר: חֶנֶק חָמוּר, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר?
human_translation: This works out well according to the one who says strangulation lenient But according to the one who says strangulation severe what can be said?
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Hanicha lem'an de'amar: chenek kal, ela lem'an de'amar: chenek chamur, mai ikka lemeimar?"

hebrew_text: נָפְקָא לֵיהּ מִדְּתַנְיָא: ״וְאַתָּה תְּבַעֵר הַדָּם הַנָּקִי מִקִּרְבֶּךָ״ – הוּקְשׁוּ כׇּל שׁוֹפְכֵי דָמִים לְעֶגְלָה עֲרוּפָה. מָה לְהַלָּן בְּסַיִיף וּמִן הַצַּוָּאר, אַף כָּאן בְּסַיִיף וּמִן הַצַּוָּאר.
human_translation: derives it from that which is taught “And so shall you put away the innocent blood from your midst” all spillers of blood are compared to the heifer whose neck is broken Just as there, by sword and at the neck, so too here, by sword and at the neck.
llm_translation: He went out from the dispute: "And you shall purge the innocent blood from your midst" - all shedders of blood are compared to a decapitated calf. Just as there, the blood is purged with a sword and from the neck, so too here, the blood is purged with a sword and from the neck.

hebrew_text: אִי, מָה לְהַלָּן בְּקוֹפִיץ וּמִמּוּל עוֹרֶף, אַף כָּאן בְּקוֹפִיץ וּמִמּוּל עוֹרֶף? אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ: אָמַר קְרָא ״וְאָהַבְתָּ לְרֵעֲךָ כָּמוֹךָ״ – בְּרוֹר לוֹ מִיתָה יָפָה.
human_translation: If just as there, with a cleaver and at the nape of the neck, so too here, with a cleaver and at the nape of the neck. Rav Naḥman says Rabba bar Avuh says: verse states: “And you shall love your neighbor as yourself” select a good, death for him.
llm_translation: Here is the English translation of the Talmudic text: "If, what is there, with a leap and from behind the neck, so too here, with a leap and from behind the neck? Rav Nachman said in the name of Rabba bar Avuh: The verse says, 'Love your neighbor as yourself' - choose for him a good death."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מִצְוַת הַנֶּחְנָקִין: הָיוּ מְשַׁקְּעִין אוֹתוֹ בְּזֶבֶל עַד אַרְכוּבּוֹתָיו, וְנוֹתֵן סוּדָר קָשָׁה לְתוֹךְ הָרַכָּה, וְכוֹרֵךְ עַל צַוָּארוֹ. זֶה מוֹשֵׁךְ אֶצְלוֹ וְזֶה מוֹשֵׁךְ אֶצְלוֹ, עַד שֶׁנַּפְשׁוֹ יוֹצֵאת.
human_translation: The mitzva of those who are strangled submerge in dung up to his knees and places a rough scarf within a soft one, and wraps around his neck. This pulls toward him, and that pulls toward him, until the soul of departs.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: The mitzvah of the stranglers: If they were sinking him in dung up to his armpits, and placing a hard cloth within the soft one, and tying it around his neck. This one pulls towards him and that one pulls towards him, until his soul departs.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״אִישׁ״ – פְּרָט לְקָטָן, ״אֲשֶׁר יִנְאַף אֶת אֵשֶׁת אִישׁ״ – פְּרָט לְאֵשֶׁת קָטָן, ״אֵשֶׁת רֵעֵהוּ״ – פְּרָט לְאֵשֶׁת אֲחֵרִים.
human_translation: The Sages taught: “A man,” excluding a minor boy “Who commits adultery with another man’s wife,” excluding the wife of a minor boy; “His neighbor’s wife” excludes the wife of another,
llm_translation: The sages taught: "A man" - excluding a minor, "who commits adultery with another man's wife" - excluding the wife of a minor, "the wife of his fellow" - excluding the wives of others.

hebrew_text: ״מוֹת יוּמָת״ – בְּחֶנֶק. אַתָּה אוֹמֵר בְּחֶנֶק, אוֹ אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא בְּאַחַת מִכׇּל מִיתוֹת הָאֲמוּרוֹת בַּתּוֹרָה? אָמַרְתָּ: כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר מִיתָה בְּתוֹרָה סְתָם, אֵין אַתָּה רַשַּׁאי לְמוֹשְׁכָהּ לְהַחְמִיר עָלֶיהָ, אֶלָּא לְהָקֵל עָלֶיהָ. דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יֹאשִׁיָּה.
human_translation: “Shall be put to death” by strangulation. Do you say by strangulation, or is it rather by one of all the death stated in the Torah? You must say everywhere that death is stated in the Torah without specification you may not take it to be more stringent with regard to it, a severe rather, to be more lenient with regard to it, the statement of Rabbi Yoshiya.
llm_translation: "Death by stoning" - by strangulation. Do you say by strangulation, or is it only one of all the deaths mentioned in the Torah? You said: Any place where death is stated in the Torah without specification, you are not permitted to interpret it strictly, but rather leniently. These are the words of Rabbi Yoshiyah.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן אוֹמֵר: לֹא מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהִיא קַלָּה, אֶלָּא כׇּל מִיתָה הָאֲמוּרָה בְּתוֹרָה סְתָם – אֵינָהּ אֶלָּא חֶנֶק.
human_translation: Rabbi Yonatan says: It is not because is lenient rather, every death stated in the Torah without specification is nothing other than strangulation,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yonatan says: Not because it is light, but every death mentioned in the Torah without specification - it is only strangulation.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: נֶאֱמַר מִיתָה בִּידֵי שָׁמַיִם, וְנֶאֱמַר מִיתָה בִּידֵי אָדָם. מָה מִיתָה הָאֲמוּרָה בִּידֵי שָׁמַיִם – מִיתָה שֶׁאֵין בָּהּ רוֹשֶׁם, אַף מִיתָה הָאֲמוּרָה בִּידֵי אָדָם – מִיתָה שֶׁאֵין בָּהּ רוֹשֶׁם.
human_translation: Rabbi says, Death at the hand of Heaven is stated and death at the hands of a person, is stated Just as death at the hand of Heaven that is stated a death that leaves no mark, so too, death at the hands of a person that is stated a death that leaves no mark,
llm_translation: Rabbi says: It is stated "death by the hands of Heaven," and it is stated "death by the hands of man." Just as the death mentioned as being by the hands of Heaven is a death that has no mark, so too the death mentioned as being by the hands of man is a death that has no mark.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא שְׂרֵיפָה? מִדְּאָמַר רַחֲמָנָא בַּת כֹּהֵן בִּשְׂרֵיפָה, מִכְּלָל דְּהָא לָאו בַּת שְׂרֵיפָה הִיא.
human_translation: But say burning, From that the Merciful One states a priest’s daughter by burning by inference that this is not liable to burning,
llm_translation: And why is it different with burning? Since the Merciful One said regarding the daughter of a Kohen who is in burning, this implies that she is not considered the daughter of burning.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַבִּי יוֹנָתָן, כִּדְקָא מְפָרֵשׁ רַבִּי טַעְמָא. אֶלָּא לְרַבִּי יֹאשִׁיָּה, מִמַּאי דְּאִיכָּא חֶנֶק בָּעוֹלָם? אֵימָא סַיִיף!
human_translation: Granted, according to Rabbi Yonatan in the manner that Rabbi explains the reason But according to Rabbi Yoshiya, from where that there is strangulation in the world, say sword
llm_translation: In peace to Rabbi Yonatan, as Rabbi Taama explained. Rather, to Rabbi Yoshiyah, from where is there choking in the world? Say: A sword!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: אַרְבַּע מִיתוֹת גְּמָרָא גְּמִירִי לְהוּ.
human_translation: Rava said: four death are learned as a tradition.
llm_translation: Rava said: Four types of death are conclusive.

hebrew_text: מַאי ״לֹא מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהִיא קַלָּה״? קָמִיפַּלְגִי בִּפְלוּגְתָּא דְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן וְרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: What It is not because is lenient disagree with regard to the dispute between Rabbi Shimon and the Rabbis,
llm_translation: What is "not because she is light"? They dispute in the opinion of Rabbi Shimon and the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי זֵירָא לְאַבָּיֵי: שְׁאָר הַנִּסְקָלִין דְּלָא כְּתִיב בְּהוּ סְקִילָה, דְּגָמְרִי מֵאוֹב וְיִדְּעוֹנִי, בְּמַאי גָּמְרִי? בְּ״מוֹת יוּמָתוּ״ גָּמְרִי, אוֹ בִּ״דְמֵיהֶם בָּם״ גָּמְרִי?
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira said to Abaye: the rest of those who are stoned with regard to whom stoning is not written because derived from a necromancer and a sorcerer, through what is derived? Is it derived from “they shall be put to death,” or is it derived from “their blood shall be upon them”?
llm_translation: He said to him Rabbi Zeira to Abbaye: The rest of the stonings that are not written with them stoning, that they learn from "with a staff" and "they shall know," with what do they learn? Do they learn with "they shall surely be put to death," or do they learn with "their blood shall be upon them"?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בִּ״דְמֵיהֶם״ ״דְּמֵיהֶם בָּם״ גָּמְרִי, דְּאִי בְּ״מוֹת יוּמָתוּ״ גָּמְרִי, ״דְּמֵיהֶם״ ״דְּמֵיהֶם״ לְמָה לִי?
human_translation: said to him: It is derived from “their blood” “their blood shall be upon them.” As, if it is derived from “they shall be put to death,” why do I “their blood” “their blood”?
llm_translation: He said to him: "With their blood" "their blood in them" they complete, for if with "their deaths they shall die" they complete, "their blood" "their blood" what do I need them for?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מַאי, בִּ״דְמֵיהֶם״ ״דְּמֵיהֶם״ גָּמְרִי? ״מוֹת יוּמָתוּ״ לְמָה לִי?
human_translation: Rather, what it is derived from “their blood” “their blood,” Why do I “they shall be put to death”?
llm_translation: Rather, what is the meaning of "their blood"? Why do they conclude "their blood"? "You shall surely put them to death" - why do I need it?

hebrew_text: כִּדְתַנְיָא: ״מוֹת יוּמַת הַמַּכֶּה רֹצֵחַ הוּא״ – אֵין לִי אֶלָּא בְּמִיתָה הַכְּתוּבָה בּוֹ. מִנַּיִין שֶׁאִם אִי אַתָּה יָכוֹל לַהֲמִיתוֹ בְּמִיתָה הַכְּתוּבָה בּוֹ, שֶׁאַתָּה מְמִיתוֹ בְּכׇל מִיתָה שֶׁאַתָּה יָכוֹל לַהֲמִיתוֹ? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״מוֹת יוּמַת הַמַּכֶּה״ – מִכׇּל מָקוֹם.
human_translation: As it is taught “He that smote him shall be put to death, for he is a murderer” I have only with the execution written concerning him, From where that if you cannot put him to death with the execution written concerning him, that you put him to death with any execution with which you can put him to death? The verse states: “He that smote him shall be put to death [ mot yumat ],” in any case,
llm_translation: As it was taught: "He shall surely be put to death, he is a murderer" - I have only learned the death that is written about him. From where do we know that if you are able to kill him with the death that is written about him, that you kill him with any death that you are able to kill him with? The Talmud teaches: "He shall surely be put to death, the one who strikes" - from any other place.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַחָא מִדִּפְתִּי לְרָבִינָא: וְאִי בְּ״מוֹת יוּמָתוּ״ גָּמְרִי, מַאי קָא קַשְׁיָא לֵיהּ?
human_translation: Rav Aḥa of Difti said to Ravina: And if is derived from “they shall be put to death,” what is difficult according to
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Acha, from Difti to Ravina: If with "mote yumatu" they concluded, what is difficult for him?

hebrew_text: אִילֵּימָא אֵשֶׁת אִישׁ קָא קַשְׁיָא לֵיהּ, לְמֵיתֵי וּלְמִיגְמַר ״מוֹת יוּמַת״ מֵאוֹב וְיִדְּעוֹנִי: מָה לְהַלָּן בִּסְקִילָה, אַף כָּאן בִּסְקִילָה?
human_translation: If we say a married woman a difficulty according to we should derive and learn from shall be put to death” a necromancer and a sorcerer just as there, by stoning, so too here, by stoning,
llm_translation: Firstly, the wife of a man is difficult for him, to kill and to finish "he shall surely be put to death" from a necromancer and a soothsayer: just as there with stoning, so too here with stoning?

hebrew_text: מִדְּאָמַר רַחֲמָנָא אֲרוּסָה בִּסְקִילָה, מִכְּלָל דִּנְשׂוּאָה לָאו בִּסְקִילָה.
human_translation: From that the Merciful One states a betrothed woman by stoning, by inference that a married woman is not by stoning,
llm_translation: From the statement "a betrothed woman is subject to stoning," it can be inferred that marriage is not subject to stoning.

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא, מַכֵּה אָבִיו וְאִמּוֹ קָא קַשְׁיָא לֵיהּ, לְמֵיתֵי וּלְמִיגְמַר מֵאוֹב וְיִדְּעוֹנִי?
human_translation: And rather one who wounds his father or his mother a difficulty according to we should derive and learn from a necromancer and a sorcerer
llm_translation: But rather, striking his father and mother is difficult for him, to put him to death and to cut him off from among his people?

hebrew_text: עַד דְּגָמְרִי מֵאוֹב וְיִדְּעוֹנִי, לִיגְמְרוּ מֵאֵשֶׁת אִישׁ, דְּאִי אַתָּה רַשַּׁאי לְמוֹשְׁכָהּ לְהַחְמִיר עָלֶיהָ, אֶלָּא לְהָקֵל עָלֶיהָ.
human_translation: Rather than deriving from a necromancer and a sorcerer, let us derive from a married woman, everywhere that death is stated in the Torah without specification you may not take it to be more stringent with regard to it, a severe rather, to be more lenient with regard to it,
llm_translation: Until they finish from the necromancer and the wizard, let them finish from a man's wife, for if you are permitted to draw her to be strict upon her, rather be lenient upon her.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: שְׁאָר הַנִּסְקָלִין גּוּפַיְיהוּ קָא קַשְׁיָא לֵיהּ, דְּאִי בְּ״מוֹת יוּמָת״ גָּמְרִי, עַד דְּגָמְרִי מֵאוֹב וְיִדְּעוֹנִי, לִיגְמְרוּ מֵאֵשֶׁת אִישׁ!
human_translation: said to the rest of those who are stoned, themselves, a difficulty to because if is derived from “they shall be put to death,” rather than deriving from a necromancer and a sorcerer let us derive from a married woman,
llm_translation: He said to him: The rest of the stonings themselves are difficult for him, for if they have completed "he shall surely be put to death," until they complete from the medium and the familiar spirit, let them complete from a married woman!

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אֵלּוּ הֵן הַנִּסְקָלִין: הַבָּא עַל הָאֵם, וְעַל אֵשֶׁת הָאָב, וְעַל הַכַּלָּה, וְעַל הַזְּכוּר, וְעַל הַבְּהֵמָה, וְהָאִשָּׁה הַמְּבִיאָה אֶת הַבְּהֵמָה. וְהַמְגַדֵּף, וְהָעוֹבֵד עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה, וְהַנּוֹתֵן מִזַּרְעוֹ לַמּוֹלֶךְ, וּבַעַל אוֹב וְיִדְּעוֹנִי, וְהַמְחַלֵּל אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת, וְהַמְקַלֵּל אָבִיו וְאִמּוֹ, וְהַבָּא עַל נַעֲרָה הַמְאוֹרָסָה, וְהַמֵּסִית, וְהַמֵּדִיחַ, וְהַמְכַשֵּׁף, וּבֵן סוֹרֵר וּמוֹרֶה.
human_translation: These are those who are stoned One who engages in intercourse with mother; or with father’s wife, or with daughter-in-law; or with a male; or with an animal; and a woman who engages in intercourse with an animal. And one who blasphemes, and one who engages in idol worship. And one who gives of his offspring to Molekh, and a necromancer, and a sorcerer. And one who desecrates Shabbat, and one who curses his father or his mother, and one who engages in intercourse with a betrothed young woman, and an inciter and a subverter and a warlock, and a stubborn and rebellious son.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: These are the ones who are stoned: One who has relations with his mother, with his father's wife, with a married woman, with a male, with an animal, and a woman who brings an animal for bestiality. Also, one who curses God, one who worships idols, one who gives his seed to Molech, one who practices necromancy or divination, one who desecrates the Sabbath, one who curses his father or mother, one who has relations with a betrothed maiden, one who entices others to idolatry, one who leads others astray, one who practices sorcery, and a rebellious and defiant son.

hebrew_text: הַבָּא עַל הָאֵם, חַיָּיב עָלֶיהָ מִשּׁוּם אֵם וּמִשּׁוּם אֵשֶׁת אָב. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב אֶלָּא מִשּׁוּם הָאֵם בִּלְבַד.
human_translation: One who engages in intercourse with mother liable for her: due to mother and due to father’s wife. Rabbi Yehuda says: He is liable only due to mother.
llm_translation: The one who comes upon the mother, is obligated upon her from the status of mother and from the status of stepmother. Rabbi Yehuda says: He is only obligated from the status of mother alone.

hebrew_text: הַבָּא עַל אֵשֶׁת אָב, חַיָּיב מִשּׁוּם אֵשֶׁת אָב וּמִשּׁוּם אֵשֶׁת אִישׁ, בֵּין בְּחַיֵּי אָבִיו בֵּין לְאַחַר מִיתַת אָבִיו, בֵּין מִן הָאֵירוּסִין בֵּין מִן הַנִּישּׂוּאִין.
human_translation: One who engages in intercourse with father’s wife liable due to father’s wife and due to a married woman. both during his father’s lifetime and after his father’s death, whether of betrothal or of marriage.
llm_translation: One who comes upon his father's wife, is liable both on account of his father's wife and on account of his wife, whether during his father's lifetime or after his father's death, whether from betrothal or from marriage.

hebrew_text: הַבָּא עַל כַּלָּתוֹ, חַיָּיב עָלֶיהָ מִשּׁוּם כַּלָּתוֹ וּמִשּׁוּם אֵשֶׁת אִישׁ, בֵּין בְּחַיֵּי בְנוֹ בֵּין לְאַחַר מִיתַת בְּנוֹ, בֵּין מִן הָאֵירוּסִין בֵּין מִן הַנִּישּׂוּאִין.
human_translation: one who engages in intercourse with his daughter-in-law liable for her: due to daughter-in-law, and due to a married woman. both during his son’s lifetime after his son’s death, whether of betrothal or of marriage.
llm_translation: The one who comes upon his daughter-in-law, is obligated upon her because of his daughter-in-law and because of the wife of a man, whether during the lifetime of his son or after the death of his son, whether from betrothal or from marriage.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תַּנְיָא: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר, אִם לֹא הָיְתָה אִמּוֹ רְאוּיָה לְאָבִיו, אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב אֶלָּא מִשּׁוּם הָאֵם בִּלְבַד.
human_translation: it is taught Rabbi Yehuda says: If his mother was not suitable for his father, he is liable only due to the mother,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara: Rabbi Yehuda says, if his mother was not fitting for his father, he is only obligated due to the mother alone.

hebrew_text: מַאי ״אֵינָהּ רְאוּיָה לוֹ״? אִילֵּימָא חַיָּיבֵי כָרֵיתוֹת וְחַיָּיבֵי מִיתוֹת בֵּית דִּין, מִכְּלָל דְּרַבָּנַן סָבְרִי אַף עַל גַּב דְּאֵינָהּ רְאוּיָה לוֹ? הָא לֵית לֵיהּ קִידּוּשִׁין בְּגַוַּוהּ!
human_translation: What is not suitable for him? If we say liable to excision from the World-to-Come [ karet ], or liable to court death by inference, that the Rabbis hold even if she is not suitable for him. Doesn’t has no betrothal with regard to her?
llm_translation: What is "it is not fitting for him"? If you say it refers to those liable for excision and those liable for death by the court, do the Rabbis hold that even though "it is not fitting for him," there are no betrothals with him!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: חַיָּיבֵי לָאוִין, וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, דְּאָמַר: אֵין קִידּוּשִׁין תּוֹפְסִין בְּחַיָּיבֵי לָאוִין.
human_translation: Rather, liable for a prohibition And Rabbi Yehuda holds in accordance with Rabbi Akiva, who says betrothal does not take effect with is liable a prohibition
llm_translation: Rather: those liable for prohibitions, and Rabbi Yehuda holds like Rabbi Akiva, who said: betrothals do not take effect on those liable for prohibitions.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַב אוֹשַׁעְיָא: אִיסּוּר מִצְוָה וְאִיסּוּר קְדוּשָּׁה – חוֹלְצוֹת וְלֹא מִתְיַיבְּמוֹת.
human_translation: Rav Oshaya raises an objection a prohibition a mitzva or a prohibition sanctity, she performs ḥalitza and she does not enter into levirate marriage.
llm_translation: Rav Oshaya raises an objection: The prohibition of a mitzvah and the prohibition of sanctity - halutzot but not yibum.

hebrew_text: אִיסּוּר מִצְוָה – שְׁנִיּוֹת מִדִּבְרֵי סוֹפְרִים. וְאַמַּאי קָרוּ לְהוּ אִיסּוּר מִצְוָה? שֶׁמִּצְוָה לִשְׁמוֹעַ דִּבְרֵי חֲכָמִים.
human_translation: A prohibition a mitzva secondary relatives, by rabbinic law. And why do call it a prohibition a mitzva? Because it is a mitzva to listen to the words of the Sages.
llm_translation: Prohibition of a commandment - secondary prohibitions from the words of the Sages. And why are they called "prohibition of a commandment"? Because it is a commandment to listen to the words of the Sages.

hebrew_text: אִיסּוּר קְדוּשָּׁה – אַלְמָנָה לְכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל, גְּרוּשָׁה וַחֲלוּצָה לְכֹהֵן הֶדְיוֹט. וְאַמַּאי קָרוּ לְהוּ אִיסּוּר קְדוּשָּׁה? דִּכְתִיב: ״קְדֹשִׁים יִהְיוּ לֵאלֹהֵיהֶם״.
human_translation: A prohibition sanctity a widow to a High Priest, a divorcée or a woman who has performed ḥalitza [ ḥalutza ], to an ordinary priest. And why do call it a prohibition sanctity? As it is written “They shall be sanctified to their God”
llm_translation: Prohibition of Holiness - A widow for a High Priest, a divorcee and a halutzah for an ordinary priest. And why are they called Prohibition of Holiness? For it is written: "They shall be holy to their God."

hebrew_text: וְתַנְיָא עֲלַהּ: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה מַחְלִיף.
human_translation: And it is taught with regard to Rabbi Yehuda switches
llm_translation: "And it was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi Yehuda interchanged."

hebrew_text: חַלּוֹפֵי הוּא דְּמַחְלֵיף, הָא חֲלִיצָה בָּעֲיָא. וְאִי סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ רַבִּי יְהוּדָה כְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא סְבִירָא לֵיהּ, מִכְּדִי חַיָּיבֵי לָאוִין לְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא כְּחַיָּיבֵי כָרֵיתוֹת דְּמֵי, וְחַיָּיבֵי כָרֵיתוֹת לָאו בְּנֵי חֲלִיצָה וְיִבּוּם נִינְהוּ!
human_translation: He switches but she requires ḥalitza . And if it enters your mind Rabbi Yehuda holds in accordance with Rabbi Akiva, after all, liable for prohibitions, according to Rabbi Akiva, are considered like those liable to karet , and those liable to karet are not capable of ḥalitza and levirate marriage,
llm_translation: It is a dispute of one who exchanges, here chalitza is required. And if it is according to your opinion, Rabbi Yehuda holds like Rabbi Akiva, he holds that they are liable like the liabilities of monetary penalties, and the liabilities of monetary penalties are not like the liabilities of chalitza and yibum!

hebrew_text: לִדְבָרָיו דְּתַנָּא קַמָּא קָאָמַר, וְלֵיהּ לָא סְבִירָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: stated in accordance with the statement of the first tanna ; but he himself does not hold accordingly.
llm_translation: According to the words of the first Tanna, and according to him, he does not agree with him.

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא רַבִּי יִצְחָק, תָּנֵי כְּדִתְנַן: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר, אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב אֶלָּא מִשּׁוּם הָאֵם בִּלְבַד.
human_translation: When Rav Yitzḥak came he taught as we learned Rabbi Yehuda says: is liable only due to the mother,
llm_translation: When Rabbi Yitzchak came, he taught as we learned: Rabbi Yehuda says, one is only liable due to the mother alone.

hebrew_text: וְטַעְמָא מַאי? אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: דְּאָמַר קְרָא ״אִמְּךָ הִיא״. מִשּׁוּם אִמּוֹ אַתָּה מְחַיְּיבוֹ, וְאִי אַתָּה מְחַיְּיבוֹ מִשּׁוּם אֵשֶׁת אָב.
human_translation: And what is the reason Abaye says: because the verse states: She is your mother; you shall render him liable due to his mother, but you shall not render him liable due to father’s wife.
llm_translation: The reason what? Said Abbaye: for it says in the verse "your mother she is." Because of his mother you are obligated to him, and if you are not obligated to him because of his mother, you are obligated to him because of his father's wife.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, ״עֶרְוַת אֵשֶׁת אָבִיךָ לֹא תְגַלֵּה עֶרְוַת אָבִיךָ הִיא״, מִשּׁוּם אֵשֶׁת אָב אַתָּה מְחַיְּיבוֹ, וְאִי אַתָּה מְחַיְּיבוֹ מִשּׁוּם אִמּוֹ?
human_translation: If that is so, “The nakedness of your father’s wife you shall not uncover; it is your father’s nakedness” you shall render him liable due to father’s wife, but you shall not render him liable due to his mother.
llm_translation: Rather from now on, "The nakedness of your father's wife you shall not uncover; it is your father's nakedness" - because of the wife of your father you are obligated, and if you are obligated because of your mother?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אִמּוֹ שֶׁהִיא אֵשֶׁת אָבִיו, קָאֵי הָכָא וּמְמַעֵט לַהּ, קָאֵי הָכָא וּמְמַעֵט לַהּ. הַשְׁתָּא, אִמּוֹ שֶׁאֵינָהּ אֵשֶׁת אָבִיו – מִיחַיַּיב, אֵשֶׁת אָבִיו שֶׁאֵינָהּ אִמּוֹ – מִיחַיַּיב, אִמּוֹ שֶׁהִיא אֵשֶׁת אָבִיו – לָא מִיחַיַּיב כְּלָל?
human_translation: But mother who is his father’s wife, stands, here, and excludes stands there, and excludes now his mother who is not his father’s wife he is rendered liable, his father’s wife who is not his mother he is rendered liable, his mother who is his father’s wife he is not rendered liable at all,
llm_translation: Rather, his mother who is the wife of his father, stands here and diminishes for her, stands here and diminishes for her. Now, his mother who is not the wife of his father - he is liable, the wife of his father who is not his mother - he is liable, his mother who is the wife of his father - is he not liable at all?

hebrew_text: וְתוּ, לְרַבָּנַן נָמֵי, הָכְתִיב ״אִמְּךָ הִיא״? אֶלָּא, הָהוּא מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְכִדְרַב שִׁישָׁא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִידִי. לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה נָמֵי, הָהוּא מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְכִדְרַב שִׁישָׁא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִידִי.
human_translation: And furthermore, according to the Rabbis too, isn’t “She is your mother,” written; Rather, that necessary for Rav Sheisha, son of Rav Idi, according to Rabbi Yehuda as well, that necessary for Rav Sheisha, son of Rav Idi,
llm_translation: And come, to the Rabbis it is written "your mother she is"? Rather, that one asked according to Rav Shisha son of Rav Idi. To Rabbi Yehuda it is written, that one asked according to Rav Shisha son of Rav Idi.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִיקָא: אָמַר קְרָא ״עֶרְוָתָהּ״, מִשּׁוּם עֶרְוָה אַחַת אַתָּה מְחַיְּיבוֹ, וְאִי אַתָּה מְחַיְּיבוֹ מִשּׁוּם שְׁתֵּי עֲרָיוֹת.
human_translation: Rather, Rav Aḥa, son of Rav Ika, says The verse states: her nakedness [ ervatah ],” you shall render him liable for one forbidden sexual relationship [ erva ], but you shall not render him liable for two forbidden sexual relationships.
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Acha, son of Rav Ika, said: The verse states "her nakedness," because of one nakedness you obligate him, and if you do not obligate him because of one nakedness, you obligate him because of two nakednesses.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה: ״עֶרְוַת כַּלָּתְךָ לֹא תְגַלֵּה אֵשֶׁת בִּנְךָ הִיא לֹא תְגַלֶּה עֶרְוָתָהּ״ – הָכִי נָמֵי מִשּׁוּם עֶרְוָה אַחַת אַתָּה מְחַיְּיבוֹ וְאִי אַתָּה מְחַיְּיבוֹ מִשּׁוּם שְׁתֵּי עֲרָיוֹת?
human_translation: If that is so, “You shall not uncover the nakedness of your daughter-in-law; she is your son’s wife, you shall not uncover her nakedness” also you shall render him liable for one forbidden sexual relationship, but you shall not render him liable for two forbidden sexual relationships?
llm_translation: Rather from now on: "The nakedness of your daughter-in-law you shall not uncover; she is your son's wife; you shall not uncover her nakedness" – is it so that due to one nakedness you obligate him, and if you do not obligate him, is it due to two nakednesses?

hebrew_text: וְהָתְנַן: הַבָּא עַל כַּלָּתוֹ חַיָּיב עָלֶיהָ מִשּׁוּם כַּלָּתוֹ וּמִשּׁוּם אֵשֶׁת אִישׁ, בֵּין בְּחַיֵּי בְנוֹ בֵּין לְאַחַר מִיתַת בְּנוֹ, וְלָא פְּלִיג רַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: But didn’t we learn One who engages in intercourse with his daughter-in-law liable for her: due to daughter-in-law, and due to a married woman; both during his son’s lifetime and after his son’s death. And Rabbi Yehuda does not dispute
llm_translation: And we learned in a Mishnah: One who engages in relations with his daughter-in-law is liable to her both on account of his daughter-in-law and on account of his son's wife, whether during the lifetime of his son or after the death of his son, and Rabbi Yehuda does not disagree.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, כֵּיוָן דְּחַד גּוּפָא הוּא, אַף עַל גַּב דִּתְרֵי אִיסּוּרֵי נִינְהוּ, כְּתִיב ״עֶרְוָתָהּ״. הָכָא נָמֵי, כֵּיוָן דְּחַד גּוּפָא הוּא, אַף עַל גַּב דִּתְרֵי אִיסּוּרֵי נִינְהוּ, כְּתִיב ״עֶרְוָתָהּ״.
human_translation: Rather, since one body, although two prohibitions, “her nakedness [ ervatah ],” is written. Here too, since one body, although are two prohibitions, “her nakedness [ ervatah ]” is written.
llm_translation: Rather, since it is one entity, even though there are two prohibitions, it is written "her nakedness." Here too, since it is one entity, even though there are two prohibitions, it is written "her nakedness."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: קָסָבַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה ״עֶרְוַת אָבִיךָ״ – זוֹ אֵשֶׁת אָבִיךָ, וּמַיְיתֵי לַהּ בִּגְזֵירָה שָׁוָה.
human_translation: Rather, Rava says Rabbi Yehuda holds “the nakedness of your father,” this is your father’s wife. And he derives by means of a verbal analogy
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said: Rabbi Yehuda holds that "the nakedness of your father" - this refers to the wife of your father, and he derives it through a gezeirah shavah.

hebrew_text: וּמַשְׁמַע, בֵּין אֵשֶׁת אָבִיו שֶׁהִיא אִמּוֹ בֵּין אֵשֶׁת אָבִיו שֶׁאֵינָהּ אִמּוֹ. אִמּוֹ שֶׁאֵינָהּ אֵשֶׁת אָבִיו מִנַּיִין? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״עֶרְוַת אִמְּךָ לֹא תְגַלֵּה אִמְּךָ הִיא״. מִשּׁוּם אִמּוֹ אַתָּה מְחַיְּיבוֹ, וְאִי אַתָּה מְחַיְּיבוֹ מִשּׁוּם אֵשֶׁת אָבִיו.
human_translation: And indicates whether his father’s wife who is his mother whether his father’s wife who is not his mother. From where his mother who is not his father’s wife The verse states “The nakedness of your mother you shall not uncover.” “She is your mother,” you shall render him liable due to his mother, but you shall not render him liable due to his father’s wife.
llm_translation: And it is heard, between the wife of his father who is his mother, and between the wife of his father who is not his mother. His mother who is not the wife of his father, from where? The Talmud teaches to say: "The nakedness of your mother you shall not uncover, she is your mother." Because of his mother you obligate him, and if you do not obligate him because of his mother, you obligate him because of the wife of his father.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּוָותֵיהּ דְּרָבָא: ״אִישׁ״ – פְּרָט לְקָטָן.
human_translation: It is taught in accordance with of Rava: “The man,” excludes a minor.
llm_translation: It was taught in accordance with the opinion of Rava: "אִישׁ" - excluding a minor.

hebrew_text: ״אֲשֶׁר יִשְׁכַּב אֶת אֵשֶׁת אָבִיו״ – מַשְׁמָע בֵּין אֵשֶׁת אָבִיו שֶׁהִיא אִמּוֹ, וּבֵין אֵשֶׁת אָבִיו שֶׁלֹּא אִמּוֹ. אִמּוֹ שֶׁאֵינָהּ אֵשֶׁת אָבִיו מִנַּיִין? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״עֶרְוַת אָבִיו גִּלָּה״, מוּפְנֶה לְהַקִּישׁ וְלָדוּן מִמֶּנּוּ גְּזֵרָה שָׁוָה.
human_translation: “who lies with his father’s wife” indicates whether his father’s wife who is his mother or whether his father’s wife who is not his mother. From where his mother who is not his father’s wife? The verse states: “He has uncovered his father’s nakedness.” free, to compare and learn a verbal analogy from it,
llm_translation: "Whoever lies with his father's wife" – implies whether his father's wife who is his mother, or his father's wife who is not his mother. How do we know that his mother, who is not his father's wife, is included? The Talmud teaches: "He has uncovered his father's nakedness," which is directed to draw an analogy and make a similar decree from it.

hebrew_text: ״מוֹת יוּמְתוּ״ – בִּסְקִילָה. אַתָּה אוֹמֵר בִּסְקִילָה, אוֹ אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא בְּאַחַת מִכׇּל מִיתוֹת הָאֲמוּרוֹת בַּתּוֹרָה? נֶאֱמַר כָּאן ״דְּמֵיהֶם בָּם״, וְנֶאֱמַר בְּאוֹב וְיִדְּעוֹנִי ״דְּמֵיהֶם בָּם״. מָה לְהַלָּן בִּסְקִילָה, אַף כָּאן בִּסְקִילָה.
human_translation: shall be put to death” by stoning. Do you say by stoning, or is it rather by one of all the death that are stated in the Torah? It is stated here: “Their blood shall be upon them,” and it is stated with regard to a necromancer and a sorcerer: “Their blood shall be upon them” Just as there by stoning, so too here, by stoning.
llm_translation: "Death they shall surely be put to death" - by stoning. Do you say by stoning, or is it only with one of all the deaths mentioned in the Torah? It is stated here "their blood shall be upon them," and it is stated in the case of a medium and a familiar spirit "their blood shall be upon them." Just as there in the case of a medium and a familiar spirit it is by stoning, so too here in this case it is by stoning.

hebrew_text: עוֹנֶשׁ שָׁמַעְנוּ, אַזְהָרָה מִנַּיִין? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״עֶרְוַת אָבִיךָ לֹא תְגַלֵּה״. ״עֶרְוַת אָבִיךָ״ – זוֹ אֵשֶׁת אָבִיךָ.
human_translation: We have learned punishment From where prohibition The verse states: “The nakedness of your father you shall not uncover” “the nakedness of your father” is your father’s wife.
llm_translation: Punishment we heard, warning from where? Scripture says: "The nakedness of your father you shall not uncover." "The nakedness of your father" - this refers to the wife of your father.

hebrew_text: אַתָּה אוֹמֵר: ״אֵשֶׁת אָבִיךָ״, אוֹ אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא עֶרְוַת אָבִיךָ מַמָּשׁ? נֶאֱמַר כָּאן ״עֶרְוַת אָבִיךָ לֹא תְגַלֵּה״, וְנֶאֱמַר לְהַלָּן ״עֶרְוַת אָבִיו גִּלָּה״. מָה לְהַלָּן בְּאִישׁוּת הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר, אַף כָּאן בְּאִישׁוּת הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר.
human_translation: Do you say your father’s wife, or is it rather the nakedness of your father literally, It is stated here: “The nakedness of your father…you shall not uncover,” and it is stated there, he has uncovered his father’s nakedness” Just as there, the verse is speaking of marriage, so too here, the verse is speaking of marriage,
llm_translation: You say: "The wife of your father," or is it specifically the nakedness of your father himself? It is stated here "The nakedness of your father you shall not uncover," and it is stated elsewhere "He uncovered the nakedness of his father." Just as there, the Scripture is speaking about the relationship, so too here the Scripture is speaking about the relationship.

hebrew_text: וּמַשְׁמָע, בֵּין אֵשֶׁת אָבִיו שֶׁהִיא אִמּוֹ, בֵּין אֵשֶׁת אָבִיו שֶׁאֵינָהּ אִמּוֹ. אִמּוֹ שֶׁאֵינָהּ אֵשֶׁת אָבִיו מִנַּיִין? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״עֶרְוַת אִמְּךָ לֹא תְגַלֵּה״.
human_translation: And indicates whether his father’s wife who is his mother whether his father’s wife who is not his mother. From where his mother who is not his father’s wife? The verse states: “The nakedness of your mother you shall not uncover”
llm_translation: And it is heard, whether the wife of his father who is his mother, or the wife of his father who is not his mother. His mother who is not the wife of his father, from where? The Talmud teaches: "The nakedness of your mother you shall not uncover."

hebrew_text: אֵין לִי אֶלָּא בְּאַזְהָרָה, שֶׁעָשָׂה הַכָּתוּב אִמּוֹ שֶׁאֵינָהּ אֵשֶׁת אָבִיו כְּאִמּוֹ שֶׁהִיא אֵשֶׁת אָבִיו. עוֹנֶשׁ מִנַּיִין?
human_translation: I have only with regard to prohibition that the verse renders his mother who is not his father’s wife like his mother who is his father’s wife. punishment, from where
llm_translation: I have only a warning, that the Scripture made his mother not his father's wife like his mother who is his father's wife. Punishment from where?

hebrew_text: נֶאֱמַר כָּאן ״עֶרְוַת אָבִיךָ לֹא תְגַלֵּה״, וְנֶאֱמַר לְהַלָּן ״עֶרְוַת אָבִיו גִּלָּה״. מָה בְּאַזְהָרָה עָשָׂה הַכָּתוּב אִמּוֹ שֶׁאֵינָהּ אֵשֶׁת אָבִיו כְּאִמּוֹ שֶׁהִיא אֵשֶׁת אָבִיו, אַף בְּעוֹנֶשׁ עָשָׂה הַכָּתוּב אִמּוֹ שֶׁאֵינָהּ אֵשֶׁת אָבִיו כְּאִמּוֹ שֶׁהִיא אֵשֶׁת אָבִיו.
human_translation: It is stated here, “The nakedness of your father…you shall not uncover” and it is stated there, “He has uncovered his father’s nakedness” just as with regard to prohibition, the verse renders his mother who is not his father’s wife like his mother who is his father’s wife, so too, with regard to punishment, the verse renders his mother who is not his father’s wife like his mother who is his father’s wife.
llm_translation: It is stated here, "The nakedness of your father you shall not uncover," and it is stated elsewhere, "The nakedness of his father he uncovered." Just as in the warning the Scripture made his mother who is not his father's wife like his mother who is his father's wife, so too in the punishment the Scripture made his mother who is not his father's wife like his mother who is his father's wife.

hebrew_text: ״אִמְּךָ הִיא״ – מִשּׁוּם אִמּוֹ אַתָּה מְחַיְּיבוֹ, וְאִי אַתָּה מְחַיְּיבוֹ מִשּׁוּם אֵשֶׁת אָב.
human_translation: “She is your mother” you render him liable due to his mother, but you do not render him liable due to father’s wife.
llm_translation: "Your mother" - because of his mother you are obligated to him, and if you are not obligated to him because of his mother, you are obligated to him because of his father's wife.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן, ״עֶרְוַת אָבִיךָ״ – מַמָּשׁ.
human_translation: And the Rabbis, “the nakedness of your father”? literally,
llm_translation: And the Rabbis, "The nakedness of your father" - literally.

hebrew_text: הַאי מִ״וְּאֶת זָכָר״ נָפְקָא? לְחַיֵּיב עָלָיו שְׁתַּיִם.
human_translation: this derived from “And with a male to render him liable two
llm_translation: This "mi'uveit zachar" emerged? He is liable upon it two.

hebrew_text: וְכִדְרַב יְהוּדָה, דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: נׇכְרִי הַבָּא עַל אָבִיו – חַיָּיב שְׁתַּיִם, הַבָּא עַל אֲחִי אָבִיו – חַיָּיב שְׁתַּיִם.
human_translation: And in accordance with of Rav Yehuda, as Rav Yehuda says: A gentile who engages in intercourse with his father liable two one who engages in intercourse with his father’s brother liable two
llm_translation: And like Rav Yehudah, for Rav Yehudah said: A non-Jew who has relations with his father – liable for two, one who has relations with his paternal uncle – liable for two.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: מִסְתַּבְּרָא מִילְּתָא דְּרַב יְהוּדָה בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל בְּשׁוֹגֵג, וּבְקׇרְבָּן. וְהַאי דְּקָאָמַר נׇכְרִי – לִישָּׁנָא מְעַלְּיָא הוּא. דְּאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ נׇכְרִי מַמָּשׁ, דִּינוֹ מַאי נִיהוּ? קְטָלָא! בִּתְרֵי קְטָלֵי קָטְלַתְּ לֵיהּ?
human_translation: Rava says: stands to reason the statement of Rav Yehuda is with regard to a Jew unwittingly. And concerns an offering, And that he said gentile, it is a euphemism, As if it enters your mind literally a gentile, what is his punishment death. you kill him twice?
llm_translation: Rava said: It appears that the matter of Rav Yehudah in Israel was unintentional, and with a sacrifice. And this that he said "a Gentile" – it is for a higher purpose. For if it were to enter your mind that he is a real Gentile, what is his judgment? Execution! You would have executed him twice over?

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: הַבָּא עַל אָבִיו – חַיָּיב שְׁתַּיִם, הַבָּא עַל אֲחִי אָבִיו – חַיָּיב שְׁתַּיִם.
human_translation: This is also taught One who engages in intercourse with his father liable two One who engages in intercourse with his father’s brother liable two
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Namely, thus: One who comes upon his father - is liable for two, one who comes upon his paternal uncle - is liable for two.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְאָמְרִי: דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: Some say that not in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda,
llm_translation: There are those who say: not like Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: וְאִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה, וּמַיְיתֵי לַהּ בְּקַל וָחוֹמֶר מֵאֲחִי אָבִיו. וּמָה אֲחִי אָבִיו, דְּקוּרְבָה דְּאָבִיו הוּא, חַיָּיב שְׁתַּיִם – אָבִיו לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן?
human_translation: And some say: You even say Rabbi Yehuda, and he derives by an a fortiori from father’s brother. And If father’s brother, who is his father’s relative, liable two his father, not all the more so
llm_translation: And there are those who say: Even if you say it is Rabbi Yehuda, and he brings it with a fortiori reasoning from his father's brother. And just as his father's brother, who is his father's relative, is liable for two offenses, should not his father all the more so?

hebrew_text: וְקָמִיפַּלְגִי בִּפְלוּגְתָּא דְּאַבָּיֵי וְרָבָא. מָר סָבַר: עוֹנְשִׁין מִן הַדִּין, וּמַר סָבַר: אֵין עוֹנְשִׁין מִן הַדִּין.
human_translation: And disagree with regard to the dispute between Abaye and Rava. Sage, holds one administers punishment on inference. And Sage, holds one does not administer punishment on inference.
llm_translation: And they argued in the dispute of Abbaye and Rava. Master A thinks: punishments from the law, and Master B thinks: punishments not from the law.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן, אַזְהָרָה לְאֵשֶׁת אָבִיו מְנָא לְהוּ? נָפְקָא לְהוּ מֵ״עֶרְוַת אֵשֶׁת אָבִיךָ לֹא תְגַלֵּה״.
human_translation: And the Rabbis, from where do they the prohibition of father’s wife? They derive it from “The nakedness of your father’s wife you shall not uncover;
llm_translation: The sages, a warning to the wife of one's father, from where do we derive it? It is derived for them from "You shall not uncover the nakedness of your father's wife."

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, הָהוּא מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְאַזְהָרָה לְאֵשֶׁת אָבִיו לְאַחַר מִיתָה.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda That is necessary for the prohibition of father’s wife after death;
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda, that one sought to warn his father's wife after his death.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן, הַהוּא מִסֵּיפָא דִּקְרָא נָפְקָא: ״עֶרְוַת אָבִיךָ הִיא״.
human_translation: And the Rabbis That is derived from the last clause of the verse: “It is your father’s nakedness.”
llm_translation: And the sages, that one from the end of the verse came out: "The nakedness of your father it is."

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, הָהוּא מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ: מִשּׁוּם אֵשֶׁת אָב אַתָּה מְחַיְּיבוֹ, וְאִי אַתָּה מְחַיְּיבוֹ מִשּׁוּם אֵשֶׁת אִישׁ.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda That is necessary to you render him liable due to father’s wife, but you do not render him liable due to a married woman.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda, that one asked him: because of the wife of a father you obligate him, and if you do not obligate him because of the wife of a man.

hebrew_text: וְהָאֲנַן תְּנַן: הַבָּא עַל אֵשֶׁת אָב, חַיָּיב עָלֶיהָ מִשּׁוּם אֵשֶׁת אָב וּמִשּׁוּם אֵשֶׁת אִישׁ, בֵּין בְּחַיֵּי אָבִיו בֵּין לְאַחַר מִיתַת אָבִיו, וְלָא פְּלִיג רַבִּי יְהוּדָה?
human_translation: But didn’t we learn One who engages in intercourse with father’s wife liable due to father’s wife and due to a married woman, both during his father’s lifetime after his father’s death? And Rabbi Yehuda does not dispute
llm_translation: And we learned in a Mishnah: One who engages in relations with his father's wife, he is liable to her both as his father's wife and as another man's wife, whether during his father's lifetime or after his father's death. And does Rabbi Yehuda not disagree?

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: פְּלִיג בְּבָרַיְיתָא.
human_translation: Abaye says: He disputes in a baraita .
llm_translation: Abbaye said: He disputes in the Baraita.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן, עוֹנֶשׁ דְּאֵשֶׁת אָבִיו לְאַחַר מִיתָה מְנָא לְהוּ? בִּשְׁלָמָא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה מַיְיתֵי לַהּ בִּגְזֵרָה שָׁוָה, אֶלָּא רַבָּנַן מְנָא לְהוּ?
human_translation: And the Rabbis, from where do they the punishment for his father’s wife after death? Granted, Rabbi Yehuda, it is derived by means of a verbal analogy. But from where do the Rabbis,
llm_translation: The Sages, what is the punishment of a man who marries his father's wife after his death? According to Rabbi Yehuda, he is liable to receive the same punishment as a decree, but what do the Sages say?

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי לָךְ: הָהוּא ״עֶרְוַת אָבִיו גִּלָּה״ דְּמַפֵּיק לַהּ רַבִּי יְהוּדָה לִגְזֵירָה שָׁוָה, מַפְּקִי לֵיהּ אִינְהוּ לְעוֹנֶשׁ דְּאֵשֶׁת אָבִיו לְאַחַר מִיתָה.
human_translation: say to you that “he has uncovered his father’s nakedness,” from which Rabbi Yehuda derives a verbal analogy, they derive from it the punishment for his father’s wife after death.
llm_translation: They said to him: that case of "he uncovered his father's nakedness" that Rabbi Yehuda deduces for it a decree similar, they deduce it to him for the punishment of his father's wife after his death.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן, עוֹנֶשׁ לְאִמּוֹ שֶׁאֵינָהּ אֵשֶׁת אָבִיו מְנָא לְהוּ? אָמַר רַב שִׁישָׁא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִידִי: אָמַר קְרָא ״אִמְּךָ הִיא״. עֲשָׂאָהּ הַכָּתוּב לְאִמּוֹ שֶׁאֵינָהּ אֵשֶׁת אָבִיו כְּאִמּוֹ שֶׁהִיא אֵשֶׁת אָבִיו.
human_translation: And the Rabbis, from where do they the punishment for his mother who is not his father’s wife? Rav Sheisha, son of Rav Idi, says: The verse states: “She is your mother” The verse renders his mother who is not his father’s wife like his mother who is his father’s wife.
llm_translation: The sages, what is the punishment for one who curses his mother who is not his father's wife? Rav Shisha, son of Rav Idi, said: The verse says, "She is your mother." The Torah made her like his mother who is his father's wife.

hebrew_text: הַבָּא עַל כַּלָּתוֹ כּוּ׳. וְלִחַיַּיב נָמֵי מִשּׁוּם אֵשֶׁת בְּנוֹ? אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: פָּתַח הַכָּתוּב בְּכַלָּתוֹ וְסִיֵּים בְּאֵשֶׁת בְּנוֹ, לוֹמַר לָךְ זוֹ הִיא כַּלָּתוֹ זוֹ הִיא אֵשֶׁת בְּנוֹ.
human_translation: one who engages in intercourse with his daughter-in-law And let him also be liable due to his son’s wife, Abaye says: The verse begins with his daughter-in-law and ends with his son’s wife, to tell you his daughter-in-law [ kallato ] is his son’s wife.
llm_translation: The one who comes upon his daughter-in-law, etc. And why is he liable specifically for the wife of his son? Abaye said: The verse begins with his daughter-in-law and ends with the wife of his son, to tell you that this one is his daughter-in-law and this one is the wife of his son.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַבָּא עַל הַזְּכוּר, וְעַל הַבְּהֵמָה, וְהָאִשָּׁה הַמְּבִיאָה אֶת הַבְּהֵמָה – בִּסְקִילָה. אִם אָדָם חָטָא, בְּהֵמָה מֶה חָטְאָה? אֶלָּא לְפִי שֶׁבָּאָה לְאָדָם תַּקָּלָה עַל יָדָהּ, לְפִיכָךְ אָמַר הַכָּתוּב תִּסָּקֵל. דָּבָר אַחֵר: שֶׁלֹּא תְּהֵא בְּהֵמָה עוֹבֶרֶת בַּשּׁוּק וְיֹאמְרוּ ״זוֹ הִיא שֶׁנִּסְקַל פְּלוֹנִי עַל יָדָהּ״.
human_translation: who engages in intercourse with a male or with an animal, and a woman who engages in intercourse with an animal, by stoning. If person sinned how did the animal sin? Rather, because a calamity was caused to a person by it, therefore the verse states it should be stoned, Alternatively, so that animal will not pass through the marketplace, and will say: This is because of which so-and-so was stoned,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who engages in relations with a male, with an animal, or a woman who brings an animal for such relations - is liable to stoning. If a man sins, what sin did the animal commit? Rather, because trouble came to man through it, therefore the verse states, "It shall be stoned." Another explanation: This law is so that an animal should not pass through the marketplace and people say, "This is the one for whom so-and-so was stoned because of it."
