hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ זָכָר מְנָא לַן? דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״אִישׁ״ – פְּרָט לְקָטָן, ״אֲשֶׁר יִשְׁכַּב אֶת זָכָר״ – בֵּין גָּדוֹל בֵּין קָטָן, ״מִשְׁכְּבֵי אִשָּׁה״ – מַגִּיד לְךָ הַכָּתוּב שֶׁשְּׁנֵי מִשְׁכָּבוֹת בָּאִשָּׁה.
human_translation: From where do we a male? as the Sages taught “man” excludes a minor boy. “lies with a male” whether an adult man whether a minor boy. “as with a woman [ mishkevei isha ],” The verse teaches you that two lying with a woman
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemar zakẖar məna lan? dətanu rabbānan: 'ish' – prat ləqatan, 'asẖer yishkav et zakẖar' – bein gadol bein qatan, 'mishkəvei isẖah' – maggid ləkha hakkatuv sheshnei mishkavot baishah." English translation: "How do we know that a male is included? For our Rabbis taught: 'man' - excludes a minor, 'who lies with a male' - whether an adult or a minor, 'the lyings of a woman' - the verse informs you that there are two lyings with a woman."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: הֲרֵי זֶה בָּא לְלַמֵּד, וְנִמְצָא לָמֵד.
human_translation: Rabbi Yishmael says: This come to teach and found to be derived
llm_translation: Rabbi Yishmael said: "Behold, this one comes to learn, and is found to have learned."

hebrew_text: ״מוֹת יוּמָתוּ״ – בִּסְקִילָה. אַתָּה אוֹמֵר בִּסְקִילָה, אוֹ אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא בְּאַחַת מִכׇּל מִיתוֹת הָאֲמוּרוֹת בַּתּוֹרָה? נֶאֱמַר כָּאן ״דְּמֵיהֶם בָּם״, וְנֶאֱמַר בְּאוֹב וְיִדְּעוֹנִי ״דְּמֵיהֶם בָּם״. מָה לְהַלָּן בִּסְקִילָה, אַף כָּאן בִּסְקִילָה.
human_translation: “they shall be put to death” by stoning. Do you say by stoning, or is it rather by one of all the death that are stated in the Torah? It is stated here: “Their blood shall be upon them,” and it is stated with regard to a necromancer and a sorcerer: “Their blood shall be upon them” Just as there by stoning, so too here, by stoning.
llm_translation: "Death they shall surely die" - by stoning. Do you say by stoning, or is it only with one of all the deaths mentioned in the Torah? It is stated here "their blood shall be upon them," and it is stated in the case of the medium and the familiar spirit "their blood shall be upon them." Just as there in the case of the medium and the familiar spirit it is by stoning, so too here in this case it is by stoning.

hebrew_text: עוֹנֶשׁ שָׁמַעְנוּ, אַזְהָרָה מִנַּיִין? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְאֶת זָכָר לֹא תִשְׁכַּב מִשְׁכְּבֵי אִשָּׁה תּוֹעֵבָה הִיא״.
human_translation: We have learned punishment from where prohibition The verse states: “And you shall not lie with a male as with a woman; it is an abomination”
llm_translation: Punishment we heard, warning from where? Scripture says: "And with a male you shall not lie as with a woman; it is an abomination."

hebrew_text: לָמַדְנוּ אַזְהָרָה לַשּׁוֹכֵב. אַזְהָרָה לַנִּשְׁכָּב מִנַּיִין? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״לֹא יִהְיֶה קָדֵשׁ מִבְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל״. וְאוֹמֵר: ״וְגַם קָדֵשׁ הָיָה בָאָרֶץ עָשׂוּ כְּכֹל הַתּוֹעֲבֹת הַגּוֹיִם אֲשֶׁר הוֹרִישׁ וְגוֹ׳״. דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל.
human_translation: We have learned prohibition for the one who engages in intercourse From where the prohibition for one who engages in intercourse The verse states: “There shall not be a sodomite [ kadesh ] among the children of Israel” And states: “And there were also sodomites [ kadesh ] in the land, they did according to all the abominations of the nations which the Lord drove out the statement of Rabbi Yishmael.
llm_translation: We have learned a warning for one who lies down. From where do we derive a warning for one who lies down? The Talmud teaches: "There shall not be a sacred one among the children of Israel." And it says: "And there was also a sacred one in the land, they did according to all the abominations of the nations which the Lord drove out, etc." These are the words of Rabbi Yishmael.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ, הֲרֵי הוּא אוֹמֵר ״וְאֶת זָכָר לֹא תִשְׁכַּב מִשְׁכְּבֵי אִשָּׁה״. קְרִי בֵּיהּ ״לֹא תִשָּׁכֵב״.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: It is not necessary it says: “And you shall not lie [ tishkav ] with a male as with a woman.” Read into You shall not enable your being lain with [ tishakhev ]
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: It is not necessary, as it says "And with a male you shall not lie as with a woman." Read it as "you shall not lie."

hebrew_text: בְּהֵמָה מְנָא לַן? דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״אִישׁ״ – פְּרָט לְקָטָן, ״אֲשֶׁר יִתֵּן שְׁכׇבְתּוֹ בִּבְהֵמָה״ – בֵּין גְּדוֹלָה בֵּין קְטַנָּה.
human_translation: From where do we an animal as the Sages taught: “man” excludes a minor boy. “lies with an animal” whether old or young.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "In what case do we derive the prohibition of bestiality from an animal? For the Rabbis taught: 'A man' - excluding a minor, 'who lies with a beast' - whether large or small." English translation:

hebrew_text: ״מוֹת יוּמָת״ – בִּסְקִילָה. אַתָּה אוֹמֵר בִּסְקִילָה, אוֹ אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא בְּאַחַת מִכׇּל מִיתוֹת הָאֲמוּרוֹת בַּתּוֹרָה? נֶאֱמַר כָּאן ״תַּהֲרֹגוּ״, וְנֶאֱמַר לְהַלָּן ״כִּי הָרֹג תַּהַרְגֶנּוּ״. מָה לְהַלָּן בִּסְקִילָה, אַף כָּאן בִּסְקִילָה.
human_translation: “shall be put to death” by stoning. Do you say by stoning, or is it rather by one of all the death that are stated in the Torah? It is stated here: “You shall kill,” and it is stated there, “But you shall kill Just as there by stoning, so too here, by stoning.
llm_translation: "Death shall surely be put to death" - by stoning. Do you say by stoning, or is it only with one of all the deaths mentioned in the Torah? It is stated here "you shall surely kill," and it is stated elsewhere "for you shall surely kill him." Just as there it is by stoning, so too here it is by stoning.

hebrew_text: לָמַדְנוּ עוֹנֶשׁ לַשּׁוֹכֵב. עוֹנֶשׁ לַנִּשְׁכָּב מְנָלַן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״כׇּל שֹׁכֵב עִם בְּהֵמָה מוֹת יוּמָת״. אִם אֵינוֹ עִנְיָן לַשּׁוֹכֵב, תְּנֵיהוּ עִנְיָן לַנִּשְׁכָּב.
human_translation: We have learned punishment for one who engages in bestiality from where the punishment for one who engages in bestiality The verse states: “Whoever lies with an animal shall be put to death” If is not matter of the one who lies apply it matter of the one who lie with
llm_translation: We have learned the punishment for the one who lies down. From where do we derive the punishment for the one who causes another to lie down? The Scripture teaches: "Whoever lies with an animal shall surely be put to death." If it is not a matter for the one who lies down, it is certainly a matter for the one who causes another to lie down.

hebrew_text: לָמַדְנוּ עוֹנֶשׁ בֵּין לַשּׁוֹכֵב בֵּין לַנִּשְׁכָּב. אַזְהָרָה מִנַּיִין? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וּבְכׇל בְּהֵמָה לֹא תִתֵּן שְׁכׇבְתְּךָ לְטׇמְאָה בָהּ״.
human_translation: We have learned punishment for both one who engages in bestiality and one who engages in bestiality from where prohibition The verse states: “And you shall not lie with any animal to defile yourself with it”
llm_translation: We have learned the punishment, whether for the one who lies with or for the one who is lain with. From where is the warning derived? The teaching states: "And in any beast you shall not give your lying down to defile yourself with it."

hebrew_text: לָמַדְנוּ אַזְהָרָה לַשּׁוֹכֵב. לַנִּשְׁכָּב מִנַּיִין? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״לֹא יִהְיֶה קָדֵשׁ מִבְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל״, וְאוֹמֵר: ״וְגַם קָדֵשׁ הָיָה בָּאָרֶץ וְגוֹ׳״. דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל.
human_translation: We have learned prohibition for one who engages in bestiality From where for one who engages in bestiality The verse states: “There shall not be a kadesh among the children of Israel,” and states: “And there were also kadesh in the land,” the statement of Rabbi Yishmael.
llm_translation: We have learned a warning for one who lies down. From where do we derive the prohibition for one who lies down? The verse teaches: "There shall not be a harlot of the daughters of Israel," and it also states: "And there was also a harlot in the land, etc." These are the words of Rabbi Yishmael.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ, הֲרֵי הוּא אוֹמֵר ״לֹא תִתֵּן שְׁכׇבְתְּךָ״ – לֹא תִתֵּן שְׁכִיבָתְךָ.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: It is not necessary it says: “You shall not lie [ shekhovtekha ],” You shall not enable your being lain with [ shekhivatkha ].
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: It is not necessary, as he says, "Do not give your lying down" - do not give your lying down.

hebrew_text: הַבָּא עַל הַזְּכוּר, וְהֵבִיא עָלָיו זָכָר.
human_translation: one who engages in intercourse with a male, and causes a male to engage in intercourse with him,
llm_translation: The one who comes upon the male, and brings upon him a male.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: לְדִבְרֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל חַיָּיב שְׁתַּיִם, חֲדָא מִ״לֹּא תִשְׁכַּב״ וַחֲדָא מִ״לֹּא יִהְיֶה קָדֵשׁ״. לְדִבְרֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב אֶלָּא אַחַת. ״לֹא תִשְׁכַּב״ ״לֹא תִשָּׁכֵב״ חֲדָא הִיא.
human_translation: Rabbi Abbahu says: According to the statement of Rabbi Yishmael, liable two One from “You shall not lie,” and one from “There shall not be a sodomite,” according to the statement of Rabbi Akiva, he is liable only one “you shall not lie [ tishkav ]” you shall not enable your being lain with [ tishakhev ] are one
llm_translation: Rabbi Avahu said: According to the words of Rabbi Yishmael, one is liable for two violations, one for "do not lie" and one for "do not profane." According to the words of Rabbi Akiva, one is liable for only one violation. "Do not lie" and "do not profane" are one and the same.

hebrew_text: הַבָּא עַל הַבְּהֵמָה וְהֵבִיא בְּהֵמָה עָלָיו, אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: לְדִבְרֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל חַיָּיב שְׁתַּיִם, חֲדָא מִ״לֹּא תִתֵּן שְׁכׇבְתְּךָ״ וַחֲדָא מִ״לֹּא יִהְיֶה קָדֵשׁ״. לְדִבְרֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב אֶלָּא אַחַת, ״שְׁכׇבְתְּךָ״ וּ״שְׁכִיבָתְךָ״ חֲדָא הִיא.
human_translation: one who engages in intercourse with an animal, and causes an animal to engage in intercourse with him Rabbi Abbahu says: According to the statement of Rabbi Yishmael liable two One from “You shall not lie,” and one from “There shall not be a sodomite.” according to the statement of Rabbi Akiva he is liable only one lie [ shekhovtekha ]” your being lain with [ shekhivatkha ] are one
llm_translation: The one who comes upon an animal and brings an animal upon himself, Rabbi Abbahu said: According to the words of Rabbi Yishmael, he is liable for two, one from "do not give your bed" and one from "do not be holy." According to the words of Rabbi Akiva, he is only liable for one, "your bed" and "your lying down" are one.

hebrew_text: אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ לְדִבְרֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל נָמֵי אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב אֶלָּא אַחַת, דְּכִי כְתִיב ״לֹא יִהְיֶה קָדֵשׁ״ – בְּגַבְרֵי כְּתִיב.
human_translation: Abaye says: Even according to the statement of Rabbi Yishmael he is liable only one as when it is written: “There shall not be a sodomite,” it is written with regard to men,
llm_translation: Abaye said: Even according to the words of Rabbi Yishmael Nami, one is only liable for one offense, as it is written, "There shall be no harlot" - it is written in the masculine form.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל, אַזְהָרָה לַנִּשְׁכָּב מְנָא לֵיהּ? נָפְקָא לֵיהּ מִ״כׇּל שֹׁכֵב עִם בְּהֵמָה מוֹת יוּמָת״. אִם אֵינוֹ עִנְיָן לַשּׁוֹכֵב, תְּנֵיהוּ עִנְיָן לַנִּשְׁכָּב.
human_translation: But according to from where Rabbi Yishmael prohibition for one who engages in bestiality He derives it from “Whoever lies with an animal shall be put to death.” If is not matter of the one who lies apply it matter of the one who lie with
llm_translation: Rather, for Rabbi Yishmael, what warning is there for one who lies with an animal? It was derived for him from "Whoever lies with an animal shall surely be put to death." If it is not a concern for the one who lies, it is a concern for the one who is lain with.

hebrew_text: וְאַפְּקֵיהּ רַחֲמָנָא לַנִּשְׁכָּב בִּלְשׁוֹן שׁוֹכֵב: מָה שׁוֹכֵב עָנַשׁ וְהִזְהִיר, אַף נִשְׁכָּב עָנַשׁ וְהִזְהִיר.
human_translation: And the Merciful One expresses of one who engages in bestiality using the term one who engages in bestiality Just as one who engages in bestiality punishes and prohibits so too, one who engages in bestiality punishes and prohibits
llm_translation: And the Merciful One decreed for him to lie down in the language of lying down: Just as lying down is punished and warned, so too lying down is punished and warned.

hebrew_text: הַנִּרְבָּע לְזָכָר וְהַנִּרְבָּע לִבְהֵמָה, אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: לְדִבְרֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא חַיָּיב שְׁתַּיִם, חֲדָא מִ״לֹּא תִשְׁכַּב״ וַחֲדָא מִ״לֹּא תִתֵּן שְׁכׇבְתְּךָ״. לְדִבְרֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב אֶלָּא אַחַת, אִידֵּי וְאִידִי ״לֹא יִהְיֶה קָדֵשׁ״ הוּא.
human_translation: one who was sodomized by a male and one with whom an animal copulated Rabbi Abbahu says according to the statement of Rabbi Akiva liable two One from “You shall not lie and one from “You shall not lie According to the statement of Rabbi Yishmael he is liable only one this and that are “There shall not be a sodomite.”
llm_translation: The half-shekel for a male and the half-shekel for an animal, Rabbi Abbahu said: According to the words of Rabbi Akiva, one is liable for two, one for "you shall not lie with" and one for "you shall not give your lying down." According to the words of Rabbi Yishmael, one is only liable for one, since "he shall not be holy" applies to both cases.

hebrew_text: אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ לְדִבְרֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל נָמֵי חַיָּיב שְׁתַּיִם, דִּכְתִיב ״כׇּל שֹׁכֵב עִם בְּהֵמָה מוֹת יוּמָת״. אִם אֵינוֹ עִנְיָן לַשּׁוֹכֵב, תְּנֵיהוּ עִנְיָן לַנִּשְׁכָּב. וְאַפְּקֵיהּ רַחֲמָנָא לַנִּשְׁכָּב בִּלְשׁוֹן שׁוֹכֵב: מָה שׁוֹכֵב – עָנַשׁ וְהִזְהִיר, אַף נִשְׁכָּב – עָנַשׁ וְהִזְהִיר.
human_translation: Abaye says: Even according to the statement of Rabbi Yishmael liable two as it is written: “Whoever lies with an animal shall be put to death.” If is not matter of one who engages in bestiality apply it matter of one who engages in bestiality And the Merciful One expresses of one who engages in bestiality using the term one who engages in bestiality Just as one who engages in bestiality punishes and prohibits so too, one who engages in bestiality punishes and prohibits
llm_translation: Abaye said: Even according to the words of Rabbi Yishmael, one is liable for two punishments, as it is written, "Whoever lies with an animal shall surely be put to death." If it is not a concern for the one lying down, it is a concern for the one being lain with. And the Merciful One distinguished the prohibition for the one being lain with using the language of the one lying down: Just as the one lying down is punished and warned, so too the one being lain with is punished and warned.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל הַבָּא עַל הַזְּכוּר, וְהֵבִיא זָכָר עָלָיו, הַבָּא עַל הַבְּהֵמָה, וְהֵבִיא בְּהֵמָה עָלָיו – בֵּין לְרַבִּי אֲבָהוּ בֵּין לְאַבָּיֵי, לְרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל חַיָּיב שָׁלֹשׁ, לְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא חַיָּיב שְׁתַּיִם.
human_translation: But one who engages in intercourse with a male, and causes a male with him, who engages in intercourse with an animal, and causes an animal with him, both according to Rabbi Abbahu and according to Abaye, according to Rabbi Yishmael liable three according to Rabbi Akiva liable two
llm_translation: But one who comes upon a male, and brings a male upon him, one who comes upon an animal, and brings an animal upon him - whether according to Rabbi Abbahu or according to Abbaye, according to Rabbi Yishmael liable three, according to Rabbi Akiva liable two.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: זְכוּר – לֹא עָשׂוּ בּוֹ קָטָן כְּגָדוֹל, בְּהֵמָה – עָשׂוּ בָּהּ קְטַנָּה כִּגְדוֹלָה.
human_translation: The Sages taught: a male, does not deem a younger boy like an older boy; an animal, does deem a young like an old
llm_translation: The sages taught: "Remember" - minors did not perform it like adults, with regard to an animal - they performed it with a small one like a large one.

hebrew_text: מַאי ״לֹא עָשׂוּ בּוֹ קָטָן כְּגָדוֹל״? אָמַר רַב: לֹא עָשׂוּ בִּיאַת פָּחוֹת מִבֶּן תֵּשַׁע שָׁנִים כְּבֶן תֵּשַׁע שָׁנִים. וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: לֹא עָשׂוּ בִּיאַת פָּחוֹת מִבֶּן שָׁלֹשׁ שָׁנִים כְּבֶן שָׁלֹשׁ שָׁנִים.
human_translation: What does not deem a younger boy like an older boy? Rav says: does not deem the intercourse of one who is less than nine years old like one who is nine years old, And Shmuel says: does not deem the intercourse of less than three years old like one who is three years old.
llm_translation: What is the meaning of "they did not do with him as with the great one"? Rav said: They did not engage in intercourse with him before the age of nine, like the age of nine. And Shmuel said: They did not engage in intercourse with him before the age of three, like the age of three.

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי קָמִיפַּלְגִי? רַב סָבַר: כֹּל דְּאִיתֵיהּ בְּשׁוֹכֵב – אִיתֵיהּ בְּנִשְׁכָּב, וְכֹל דְּלֵיתֵיהּ בְּשׁוֹכֵב – לֵיתֵיהּ בְּנִשְׁכָּב.
human_translation: With regard to what do disagree? Rav holds any that applies to one who engages in intercourse applies to one who engages in intercourse and any that does not apply to one who engages in intercourse does not apply to one who engages in intercourse
llm_translation: With what does he disagree? Rav holds: Anything that is present in a lying position is present in a standing position, and anything that is not present in a lying position is not present in a standing position.

hebrew_text: וּשְׁמוּאֵל סָבַר: ״מִשְׁכְּבֵי אִשָּׁה״ כְּתִיב.
human_translation: And Shmuel holds: It is written: as with a woman,”
llm_translation: And Samuel holds: "From lying with a woman" is written.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּוָותֵיהּ דְּרַב: זָכָר בֶּן תֵּשַׁע שָׁנִים וְיוֹם אֶחָד
human_translation: It is taught in accordance with of Rav: a male aged nine years and one day,
llm_translation: It was taught in accordance with the opinion of Rav: "A male, nine years and one day old."

hebrew_text: הַבָּא עַל הַבְּהֵמָה, בֵּין כְּדַרְכָּהּ בֵּין שֶׁלֹּא כְּדַרְכָּהּ, וְהָאִשָּׁה הַמְּבִיאָה אֶת הַבְּהֵמָה עָלֶיהָ, בֵּין כְּדַרְכָּהּ בֵּין שֶׁלֹּא כְּדַרְכָּהּ – חַיָּיב.
human_translation: one who engages in intercourse with an animal, whether in a typical manner or in an atypical manner, and a woman who engages in intercourse with an animal, whether in a typical manner or in an atypical manner, liable.
llm_translation: One who comes upon an animal, whether in its usual manner or not in its usual manner, and a woman who brings the animal upon herself, whether in its usual manner or not in its usual manner - is liable.

hebrew_text: דָּרַשׁ רַב נַחְמָן בַּר רַב חִסְדָּא: בְּאִשָּׁה שְׁנֵי מִשְׁכָּבוֹת, וּבִבְהֵמָה מִשְׁכָּב אֶחָד.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Rav Ḥisda taught: With regard to a woman two lying. But with regard to an animal one lying,
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Rav Chisda expounded: "With a woman, there are two beds, and with an animal, there is one bed."

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב פָּפָּא: אַדְּרַבָּה, אִשָּׁה דְּאוֹרְחַהּ הִיא אַמִּשְׁכָּב מִיחַיַּיב, אַמִּידַּעַם אַחֲרִינָא לָא מִיחַיַּיב. בְּהֵמָה דְּלָאו אוֹרְחָא הִיא, לִחַיַּיב עֲלַהּ עַל כׇּל נֶקֶב וָנֶקֶב.
human_translation: Rav Pappa objects to this On the contrary, a woman, whose typical manner is is rendered liable for lying is not rendered liable for something else, an animal, since it is not its typical should be rendered liable for it through each and every orifice.
llm_translation: Rav Papa objects to her: "Adrabah, a woman who is accustomed, if she lies down, is liable; if she is not accustomed, she is not liable. An animal that is not accustomed, one is liable for every penetration."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא (דְּלָא כְּתַרְוַיְיהוּ): זָכָר בֶּן תֵּשַׁע שָׁנִים וְיוֹם אֶחָד הַבָּא עַל הַבְּהֵמָה, בֵּין כְּדַרְכָּהּ בֵּין שֶׁלֹּא כְּדַרְכָּהּ, וְהָאִשָּׁה הַמְּבִיאָה אֶת הַבְּהֵמָה עָלֶיהָ, בֵּין כְּדַרְכָּהּ בֵּין שֶׁלֹּא כְּדַרְכָּהּ – חַיָּיב.
human_translation: It is taught in accordance with neither of their a male aged nine years and one day, one who engages in intercourse with an animal, whether in a typical manner, or in an atypical manner, and a woman who engages in intercourse with an animal, whether in a typical manner or in an atypical manner, liable.
llm_translation: It was taught (that it is not like their opinion): A male, nine years old and one day, who has intercourse with an animal, whether in its natural manner or not in its natural manner, and the woman who brings the animal upon herself, whether in its natural manner or not in its natural manner - is liable.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבִינָא לְרָבָא: הַמְעָרֶה בִּזְכוּר, מַהוּ?
human_translation: Ravina said to Rava: one who performs the initial stage of intercourse with male, what is
llm_translation: Ravina said to Rava: "One who caves in Zichur, what is the ruling?"

hebrew_text: הַמְעָרֶה בִּזְכוּר – מִשְׁכְּבֵי אִשָּׁה כְּתִיב בֵּיהּ. אֶלָּא, הַמְעָרֶה בִּבְהֵמָה, מַהוּ?
human_translation: one who performs the initial stage of intercourse with a male, “as with a woman” is written with regard to him, Rather, one who performs the initial stage of intercourse with an animal, what is
llm_translation: The cave in Zichur - written in it the lying of a woman. Rather, the cave in an animal, what is it?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִם אֵינוֹ עִנְיָן לְהַעֲרָאָה דִּכְתִיבָא גַּבֵּי אֲחוֹת אָבִיו וַאֲחוֹת אִמּוֹ, דְּלָא צְרִיכָא, דְּהָא אִיתַּקַּשׁ לְהַעֲרָאָה דְּנִדָּה – תְּנֵיהוּ עִנְיָן לְהַעֲרָאָה דִבְהֵמָה.
human_translation: said to him: If is not matter of the initial stage of intercourse where it is written, father’s sister and mother’s sister, as it is not necessary compared to the initial stage of intercourse with regard to a menstruating woman, apply it to matter of the initial stage of intercourse with an animal.
llm_translation: He said to him: If it is not relevant for the demonstration, as it is written regarding the sister of his father and the sister of his mother, which is unnecessary, for it is connected to the demonstration of a menstruating woman - both are relevant for the demonstration of an animal.

hebrew_text: מִכְּדֵי, בְּהֵמָה מֵחַיָּיבֵי מִיתוֹת בֵּית דִּין הִיא, לְמָה לִי דִּכְתִיב לְהַעֲרָאָה דִּידַהּ גַּבֵּי חַיָּיבֵי כָרֵיתוֹת? לִכְתְּבֵיהּ גַּבֵּי חַיָּיבֵי מִיתוֹת בֵּית דִּין, וְלִיגְמוֹר חַיָּיבֵי מִיתוֹת בֵּית דִּין מֵחַיָּיבֵי מִיתוֹת בֵּית דִּין!
human_translation: Since an animal is among those who are liable a death why do I initial stage of intercourse with to be written concerning those who are liable karet , Let write with regard to those who are liable a death and derive those who are liable a death from those who are liable a death
llm_translation: From where do we know that regarding an animal, those who commit certain sins are liable to receive the death penalty from the court? Why do I need this verse to teach that the animal is liable in comparison to those liable to receive karet? Rather, to write it regarding those liable to receive the death penalty from the court, and to teach that those liable to receive the death penalty from the court are also liable in comparison to those liable to receive the death penalty from the court!

hebrew_text: הוֹאִיל וְכוּלֵּיהּ קְרָא לִדְרָשָׁא הוּא דְּאָתֵי, כְּתִיבָא נָמֵי מִילְּתָא דִּדְרָשָׁא.
human_translation: Since the entire verse comes for exposition, matter, is also written of an exposition,
llm_translation: Since the entire matter is for interpretation, it is as the verse comes, as it is written, also the matter of interpretation.

hebrew_text: בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ רַב אַחָדְבוּי בַּר אַמֵּי מֵרַב שֵׁשֶׁת: הַמְעָרֶה בְּעַצְמוֹ, מַהוּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: קְבַסְתַּן!
human_translation: Rav Aḥadevoi bar Ami asked Rav Sheshet: one who performs the initial stage of intercourse on himself, what is said to him: You disgust me
llm_translation: Requested of him Rav Ahadboi son of Ammi from Rav Sheshet: One who caves in by himself, what? He said to him: "Kevastan!"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: מַאי תִּיבְּעֵי לָךְ? בְּקוֹשִׁי לָא מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ, כִּי מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ בִּמְשַׁמֵּשׁ מֵת. לְמַאן דְּאָמַר מְשַׁמֵּשׁ מֵת בַּעֲרָיוֹת פָּטוּר, הָכָא פָּטוּר. וּלְמַאן דְּאָמַר חַיָּיב, הָכָא מִיחַיַּיב תַּרְתֵּי: מִיחַיַּיב אַשּׁוֹכֵב, וּמִיחַיַּיב אַנִּשְׁכָּב.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: What is your dilemma? with an erect you cannot find You can find it when performs act of intercourse a flaccid According to the one who says who engages in intercourse a flaccid with those with whom relations are forbidden, exempt, here exempt. And according to the one who says liable, rendered liable here two rendered liable for engaging in intercourse and rendered liable for engaging in intercourse
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said: What do you need it for? You do not forget it in difficulty, for you forget it in the sun. According to the one who says one who forgets in the sun is exempt from punishment for forbidden relationships, here he is exempt. And according to the one who says he is liable, here he is liable for two things: he is liable for the one who lies down and he is liable for the one who causes to lie down.

hebrew_text: בְּעוֹ מִינֵּיהּ מֵרַב שֵׁשֶׁת: גּוֹי הַבָּא עַל הַבְּהֵמָה מַהוּ? תַּקָּלָה וְקָלוֹן בָּעֵינַן, וְהָכָא תַּקָּלָה אִיכָּא, קָלוֹן לֵיכָּא? אוֹ דִילְמָא תַּקָּלָה, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין קָלוֹן?
human_translation: asked Rav Sheshet: a gentile who engages in intercourse with an animal, what is Do we need a calamity and shame, and here there is a calamity, there is no shame, Or perhaps calamity even if there is no shame?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Be'o mineih mei Rav Sheshet: goy haba al habehemah mah hu? Takalah ve'kalon ba'einan, vehacha takalah ika, kalon leika? O dilma takalah, af al pi she'ein kalon?" English translation: "A non-Jew who has relations with an animal, what is the law? We require disgrace and shame, and here there is disgrace, is there shame? Or perhaps there is disgrace, even though there is no shame?"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: תְּנֵיתוּהָ, מָה אִילָנוֹת שֶׁאֵין אוֹכְלִין וְאֵין שׁוֹתִין וְאֵין מְרִיחִין, אָמְרָה תּוֹרָה: הַשְׁחֵת, שְׂרוֹף וְכַלֵּה, הוֹאִיל וּבָאת לְאָדָם תַּקָּלָה עַל יָדָן. הַמַּתְעֶה אֶת חֲבֵירוֹ מִדַּרְכֵי חַיִּים לְדַרְכֵי מִיתָה – עַל אַחַת כַּמָּה וְכַמָּה.
human_translation: Rav Sheshet said: You learned If trees, which neither eat nor drink nor smell, the Torah says: Destroy, burn, and demolish since a calamity was caused to people by them, who leads another astray from the ways of life to the ways of death, all the more so
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet said: It was taught: What about trees that do not eat, do not drink, and do not smell? The Torah said: "Destroy, burn, and cut down, since you have come to bring trouble upon people." One who leads his fellow astray from the ways of life to the ways of death – how much more so.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, גּוֹי הַמִּשְׁתַּחֲוֶה לִבְהֶמְתּוֹ תִּיתְּסַר וּמִקַּטְלָא? מִי אִיכָּא מִידֵּי דִּלְיִשְׂרָאֵל לָא אָסַר וּלְגוֹי אָסַר?
human_translation: If that is so, a gentile who bows down to his animal, should be forbidden, and it should be killed. Is there anything that is not forbidden to a Jew, but is forbidden to a gentile?
llm_translation: Rather from now on, a non-Jew who bows down to his animal, is he liable to be executed? Is there any difference between the hands of a Jew that it is not prohibited, and for a non-Jew it is prohibited?

hebrew_text: יִשְׂרָאֵל גּוּפֵיהּ לִיתְּסַר, מִידֵּי דְּהָוֵה אַרְבִיעָה? אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: זֶה קְלוֹנוֹ מְרוּבֶּה, וְזֶה קְלוֹנוֹ מוּעָט.
human_translation: a Jew himself let be forbidden, just as it is in bestiality, Abaye says: this his shame is great; but that his shame is slight,
llm_translation: Israel, its body is not disciplined, because it is like a fourth? Abaye said: This is its great disgrace, and this is its small disgrace.

hebrew_text: וַהֲרֵי אִילָנוֹת, דְּאֵין קְלוֹנָן מְרוּבֶּה, וְאָמְרָה תּוֹרָה: הַשְׁחֵת, שְׂרוֹף וְכַלֵּה! בְּבַעֲלֵי חַיִּים קָאָמְרִינַן, דְּחָס רַחֲמָנָא עֲלַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: But trees which the shame of is not great, the Torah says: Destroy, burn, and demolish We are speaking of living animals. as the Merciful One has pity on them.
llm_translation: Behold the trees, for their disgrace is great, and the Torah said: "Destroy, burn, and annihilate!" When it comes to living creatures, we say that the Merciful One has compassion on them.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: אָמְרָה תּוֹרָה, בְּהֵמָה נֶהֱנֵית מֵעֲבֵירָה – תֵּיהָרֵג.
human_translation: Rava says The Torah states animal enjoyed transgression, it must be killed.
llm_translation: Rava said: The Torah said, "An animal that benefits from its violation - shall be killed."

hebrew_text: וַהֲרֵי אִילָנוֹת, דְּאֵין נֶהֱנִין מֵעֲבֵירָה, וְאָמְרָה תּוֹרָה: הַשְׁחֵת, שְׂרוֹף וְכַלֵּה! בְּבַעֲלֵי חַיִּים קָאָמְרִינַן, דְּחָס רַחֲמָנָא עֲלַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: But trees which do not enjoy transgression, the Torah says: Destroy, burn, and demolish. We are speaking of living animals. as the Merciful One has pity on them.
llm_translation: And behold, the trees, that do not benefit from their fruit, and the Torah said: "Destroy, burn, and finish!" We speak of living creatures, for the Merciful One has compassion on them.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: דָּבָר אַחֵר, שֶׁלֹּא תְּהֵא בְּהֵמָה עוֹבֶרֶת בַּשּׁוּק וְיֹאמְרוּ: ״זוֹ הִיא שֶׁנִּסְקַל פְּלוֹנִי עַל יָדָהּ.״ מַאי לָאו,
human_translation: Come hear Alternatively, so that animal will not pass through the marketplace, and will say: This is because of which so-and-so was stoned, What, is it not
llm_translation: Come and hear: Another explanation, that a beast should not pass through the marketplace and people say, "This is the one on whose account so-and-so was stoned." What is the reason?

hebrew_text: מִדְּסֵיפָא תַּקָּלָה וְקָלוֹן, רֵישָׁא תַּקָּלָה בְּלֹא קָלוֹן. וְהֵיכִי דָּמֵי? גּוֹי הַבָּא עַל הַבְּהֵמָה.
human_translation: from that the latter clause calamity and shame the first clause, a calamity without shame? And what are the circumstances a gentile who engages in intercourse with an animal.
llm_translation: From the end, disgrace and shame; from the beginning, disgrace without shame. And how so? A non-Jew who engages in relations with an animal.

hebrew_text: לָא, סֵיפָא תַּקָּלָה וְקָלוֹן. רֵישָׁא הָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן: דַּאֲפִילּוּ קָלוֹן בְּלֹא תַּקָּלָה נָמֵי מִחַיְּיבִי. וְהֵיכִי דָּמֵי? יִשְׂרָאֵל הַבָּא עַל הַבְּהֵמָה בְּשׁוֹגֵג, וְכִדְבָעֵי רַב הַמְנוּנָא.
human_translation: No. The latter clause a calamity and shame, this first clause teaches us that even shame without calamity is obligated And what are the circumstances a Jew who unwittingly engages in intercourse with an animal, and like which Rav Hamnuna raises a dilemma.
llm_translation: Not so, the latter part is easier and more disgraceful. The beginning, this is what it implies to us: that even disgrace without difficulty also obligates. And how so? Like the case of an Israelite who has intercourse with an animal unintentionally, as in the case of Rav Hamnuna's statement.

hebrew_text: דְּבָעֵי רַב הַמְנוּנָא: יִשְׂרָאֵל הַבָּא עַל הַבְּהֵמָה בְּשׁוֹגֵג, מַהוּ? תַּקָּלָה וְקָלוֹן בָּעֵינַן, וְהָכָא קָלוֹן אִיכָּא, תַּקָּלָה לֵיכָּא? אוֹ דִילְמָא קָלוֹן, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין תַּקָּלָה?
human_translation: As Rav Hamnuna raises a dilemma: a Jew who unwittingly engages in intercourse with an animal, what is Do we need a calamity and shame and here there is shame, there is no calamity or perhaps shame even if there is no calamity?
llm_translation: The words of Rav Hamnuna: If a Jew engages in intercourse with an animal unintentionally, what is the law? We require disgrace and shame, and here there is shame, is there no disgrace? Or perhaps there is disgrace even though there is no shame?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: תָּא שְׁמַע, בַּת שָׁלֹשׁ שָׁנִים וְיוֹם אֶחָד מִתְקַדֶּשֶׁת בְּבִיאָה, וְאִם בָּא עָלֶיהָ יָבָם קְנָאָהּ, וְחַיָּיבִין עָלֶיהָ מִשּׁוּם אֵשֶׁת אִישׁ.
human_translation: Rav Yosef says: Come hear three years and one day old is betrothed with intercourse, And if yavam , engages in intercourse with her, he acquires her and liable for her due to a married woman.
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: Come and hear, a girl of three years and one day becomes betrothed through intercourse, and if her yavam (deceased husband's brother) engages in intercourse with her, his zealotry is effective, and they are liable on her account for the sin of a married woman.

hebrew_text: וּמְטַמְּאָה אֶת בּוֹעֲלָהּ, לְטַמֵּא מִשְׁכָּב תַּחְתּוֹן כְּעֶלְיוֹן. נִיסֵּת לְכֹהֵן – אוֹכֶלֶת בִּתְרוּמָה. בָּא עָלֶיהָ אֶחָד מִן הַפְּסוּלִים – פְּסָלָהּ מִן הַכְּהוּנָּה.
human_translation: And she transmits impurity to one who engages in intercourse with her, renders lying beneath impure like above she marries a priest, she may partake of teruma one who are unfit engages in intercourse with her, he has disqualified her from the priesthood,
llm_translation: And she defiles her husband, to defile the lower bed as the upper. If she was married to a Kohen - she may eat Terumah. If one of the disqualified approaches her - he disqualifies her from the priesthood.

hebrew_text: וְאִם בָּא עָלֶיהָ אֶחָד מִכׇּל הָעֲרָיוֹת הָאֲמוּרוֹת בְּתוֹרָה, מוּמָתִין עַל יָדָהּ, וְהִיא פְּטוּרָה.
human_translation: And if one of any of those with whom relations are forbidden, who are stated in the Torah, engaged in intercourse with her, they are executed for her, and she is exempt
llm_translation: "And if one of all the forbidden relationships mentioned in the Torah comes upon her, she is disqualified through him, and she is exempt."

hebrew_text: אֶחָד מִכׇּל עֲרָיוֹת, וַאֲפִילּוּ בְּהֵמָה. וְהָא הָכָא דְּקָלוֹן אִיכָּא, תַּקָּלָה לֵיכָּא, וְקָתָנֵי: מוּמָתִין עַל יָדָהּ.
human_translation: One of any of those with whom relations are forbidden even an animal. And here, there is shame there is no calamity, and teaches: They are executed for her.
llm_translation: One of all forbidden relationships, even with an animal. And here, where there is a disgrace, there is a disgrace, and it is taught: blemishes through her hand.

hebrew_text: כֵּיוָן דִּמְזִידָה הִיא, תַּקָּלָה נָמֵי אִיכָּא, וְרַחֲמָנָא הוּא דְּחָס עֲלַהּ. עֲלַהּ דִּידַהּ חָס, אַבְּהֵמָה לָא חָס.
human_translation: Since she intentionally, there is a calamity as well, and it is the Merciful One who has pity on her has pity on her, He does not have pity on the animal.
llm_translation: Since it is intentional, a lighter punishment is there, and the Merciful One has compassion on it. If it has compassion on its own, will it not have compassion on a beast?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: תָּא שְׁמַע, בֶּן תֵּשַׁע שָׁנִים וְיוֹם אֶחָד הַבָּא עַל יְבִמְתּוֹ – קְנָאָהּ, וְאֵינוֹ נוֹתֵן גֵּט עַד שֶׁיַּגְדִּיל. וּמְטַמֵּא כְּנִדָּה לְטַמֵּא מִשְׁכָּב תַּחְתּוֹן כְּעֶלְיוֹן.
human_translation: Rava says: Come hear nine years and one day old, who engaged in intercourse with his yevama , he has acquired her but he cannot give a bill of divorce until he reaches majority. And he becomes ritually impure like a menstruating woman renders lying beneath impure like above
llm_translation: Rava said: Come and hear, a boy of nine years and one day who engages in intercourse with his yevamah - his zealotry acquires her, and he does not give a bill of divorce until he grows up. And he renders her impure as a menstruant to render the lower like the upper.

hebrew_text: פּוֹסֵל וְאֵינוֹ מַאֲכִיל, וּפוֹסֵל אֶת הַבְּהֵמָה מֵעַל גַּבֵּי הַמִּזְבֵּחַ, וְנִסְקֶלֶת עַל יָדוֹ. וְאִם בָּא עַל אַחַת מִכׇּל הָעֲרָיוֹת הָאֲמוּרוֹת בְּתוֹרָה, מוּמָתִים עַל יָדוֹ.
human_translation: he disqualifies but he does not enable to partake And he disqualifies the animal from upon the altar, and is stoned on him. And if he engaged in intercourse with one of any of those with whom relations are forbidden, who are stated in the Torah, they are executed on him,
llm_translation: Disqualifies and does not feed, and disqualifies the animal from upon the altar, and is stoned by his hand. And if he comes upon any one of all the forbidden relations mentioned in the Torah, they are put to death by his hand.

hebrew_text: וְהָא הָכָא קָלוֹן אִיכָּא, תַּקָּלָה לֵיכָּא, וְקָתָנֵי: נִסְקֶלֶת עַל יָדוֹ.
human_translation: And here, there is shame, there is no calamity, and teaches is stoned on him,
llm_translation: And here, there is a disgrace, there is a stumbling block, and it is taught: "She was stoned upon his hand."

hebrew_text: כֵּיוָן דְּמֵזִיד הוּא, תַּקָּלָה נָמֵי אִיכָּא, וְרַחֲמָנָא הוּא דְּחָס עִילָּוֵיהּ. עֲלֵיהּ דִּידֵיהּ חָס רַחֲמָנָא, אַבְּהֵמָה לָא חָס רַחֲמָנָא.
human_translation: Since he intentionally, there is a calamity as well, and it is the Merciful One who has pity on him the Merciful One has pity on him, the Merciful One does not have pity on the animal.
llm_translation: Since he did it intentionally, there is a light punishment, and it is the Merciful One who has compassion on him. Because of his own actions, the Merciful One has compassion on him, but not on the animal.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: דָּבָר אַחֵר, שֶׁלֹּא תְּהֵא בְּהֵמָה עוֹבֶרֶת בַּשּׁוּק וְיֹאמְרוּ: ״זוֹ הִיא שֶׁנִּסְקַל פְּלוֹנִי עַל יָדָהּ״. מַאי לָאו, מִדְּסֵיפָא תַּקָּלָה וְקָלוֹן, רֵישָׁא קָלוֹן בְּלֹא תַּקָּלָה? וְהֵיכִי דָּמֵי? יִשְׂרָאֵל הַבָּא עַל הַבְּהֵמָה בְּשׁוֹגֵג.
human_translation: Come hear Alternatively, so that animal will not pass through the marketplace, and will say: This is because of which so-and-so was stoned. What, is it not from that the latter clause calamity and shame the first clause, shame without a calamity? And what are the circumstances a Jew who unwittingly engages in intercourse with an animal.
llm_translation: Come and hear: Another explanation, that a beast should not pass through the marketplace and people say, "This is the one on whose account so-and-so was stoned." What is the reason? From the latter part, disgrace and shame, is disgrace without shame? And how so? An Israelite who has intercourse with an animal unintentionally.

hebrew_text: לָא, סֵיפָא תַּקָּלָה וְקָלוֹן, רֵישָׁא תַּקָּלָה בְּלֹא קָלוֹן. וְהֵיכִי דָּמֵי? גּוֹי הַבָּא עַל הַבְּהֵמָה, וּכְדִבְעוֹ מִינֵּיהּ מֵרַב שֵׁשֶׁת.
human_translation: No, the latter clause a calamity and shame, the first clause a calamity without shame. And what are the circumstances a gentile who engages in intercourse with an animal, as asked Rav Sheshet.
llm_translation: Not so, the end is light and disgrace, the beginning is light without disgrace. And how so? A non-Jew who has relations with an animal, and as a result its species is increased by six.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַמְגַדֵּף אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב עַד שֶׁיְּפָרֵשׁ הַשֵּׁם. אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן קׇרְחָה:
human_translation: One who blasphemes, is not liable unless he utters the name Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korḥa said:
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who curses is not liable until he explicitly pronounces the Name. Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korcha said:

hebrew_text: בְּכׇל יוֹם דָּנִין אֶת הָעֵדִים בְּכִינּוּי, ״יַכֶּה יוֹסִי אֶת יוֹסִי״.
human_translation: On every day judge the witnesses, an appellation Let Yosei smite Yosei,
llm_translation: In every day, we judge the witnesses with a nickname, "Yakkeh Yosi et Yosi."

hebrew_text: נִגְמַר הַדִּין, לֹא [הָיוּ] הוֹרְגִין בְּכִינּוּי, אֶלָּא מוֹצִיאִין כׇּל אָדָם לַחוּץ. שׁוֹאֲלִין אֶת הַגָּדוֹל שֶׁבֵּינֵיהֶן וְאוֹמֵר לוֹ: ״אֱמוֹר מַה שֶׁשָּׁמַעְתָּ בְּפֵירוּשׁ״. וְהוּא אוֹמֵר, וְהַדַּיָּינִין עוֹמְדִין עַל רַגְלֵיהֶן וְקוֹרְעִין, וְלֹא מְאַחִין.
human_translation: the judgment is over, they do not sentence to death based on an appellation Rather, they remove all people interrogate the eldest of and say to him: Say what you heard explicitly. And he says And the judges stand on their feet and make a tear And they do not stitch
llm_translation: The judgment was completed, they did not kill by strangulation, but they would take out all people outside. They would ask the elder among them and say to him: "Say what you heard in explanation." And he would say, and the judges would stand on their feet and tear, and not laugh.

hebrew_text: וְהַשֵּׁנִי אוֹמֵר: ״אַף אֲנִי כָּמוֹהוּ״, וְהַשְּׁלִישִׁי אוֹמֵר: ״אַף אֲנִי כָּמוֹהוּ״.
human_translation: And the second says: I too as he And the third says: I too as he
llm_translation: The first one says: "I too am like him," and the second one says: "I too am like him."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנָא: עַד שֶׁיְּבָרֵךְ שֵׁם בְּשֵׁם.
human_translation: taught unless he blesses, name with name
llm_translation: Gemara: Tana: Until he blesses the Name in the Name.

hebrew_text: מְנָהָנֵי מִילֵּי? אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: דְּאָמַר קְרָא ״וְנוֹקֵב שֵׁם וְגוֹ׳ בְּנׇקְבוֹ שֵׁם יוּמָת״.
human_translation: From where is this matter Shmuel says: which the verse states: “And he who blasphemes [ venokev ] the name when he blasphemes [ benokvo ] the name, he shall be put to death”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: What are the consequences of these matters? Shmuel said: As the verse states, "And one who blasphemes the name of the Lord shall surely be put to death" (Leviticus 24:16). English translation:

hebrew_text: מִמַּאי דְּהַאי ״נוֹקֵב״ לִישָּׁנָא דְּבָרוֹכֵי הוּא? דִּכְתִיב: ״מָה אֶקֹּב לֹא קַבֹּה אֵל״. וְאַזְהַרְתֵּיהּ מֵהָכָא: ״אֱלֹהִים לֹא תְּקַלֵּל״.
human_translation: From where that this nokev is a term for blessing, “How shall I curse [ ekkov ] whom God has not cursed?” And prohibition from here: “You shall not curse God”
llm_translation: From what is this "nokav" similar to the blessing? As it is written: "What shall I curse, whom God has not cursed?" And its warning is from here: "You shall not curse God."

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא: מִיבְרַז הוּא, דִּכְתִיב ״וַיִּקֹּב חֹר בְּדַלְתּוֹ״, וְאַזְהַרְתֵּיהּ מֵהָכָא: ״וְאִבַּדְתֶּם אֶת שְׁמָם... לֹא תַעֲשׂוּן כֵּן לַה׳ אֱלֹהֵיכֶם״?
human_translation: But say is making a hole, as it is written: “And made a hole [ vayyikkov ] in its lid” And prohibition from here: “And you shall destroy their name You shall not do so to the Lord your God”
llm_translation: And why not? Perhaps it is from the word "mivraz," as it is written, "and he bored a hole in his ear" (Exodus 21:6), and I will warn you from here: "And you shall destroy their name... You shall not do so to the Lord your God" (Deuteronomy 12:3).

hebrew_text: בָּעֵינָא שֵׁם בְּשֵׁם, וְלֵיכָּא.
human_translation: necessary name with name and not
llm_translation: We require the name in the name, and it is not so.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא דְּמַנַּח שְׁנֵי שֵׁמוֹת אַהֲדָדֵי, וּבָזַע לְהוּ? הַהוּא נוֹקֵב וְחוֹזֵר וְנוֹקֵב הוּא. וְאֵימָא דְּחָיֵיק שֵׁם אַפּוּמָּא דְסַכִּינָא, וּבָזַע בַּהּ? הַהוּא חוּרְפָּא דְסַכִּינָא הוּא דְּקָא בָזַע.
human_translation: But say that place two names one on top of the other, and tear them That making a hole and again making a hole, But say that etch name on the point of a knife and cut with it. that it is the point of the knife that is cutting,
llm_translation: And why did he establish two names for Ahadadei, and what is the reason? That one is piercing and returning and piercing he is. And why did he engrave the name of the handle of the knife, and what is the reason? That one is the disgrace of the knife that he is engraving.

hebrew_text: אֵימָא: פָּרוֹשֵׁי שְׁמֵיהּ הוּא, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיִּקַּח מֹשֶׁה וְאַהֲרֹן אֵת הָאֲנָשִׁים הָאֵלֶּה אֲשֶׁר נִקְּבוּ בְּשֵׁמוֹת״. וְאַזְהַרְתֵּיהּ מֵהָכָא: ״אֵת ה׳ אֱלֹהֶיךָ תִּירָא״.
human_translation: Say utterance of the name of As it is written: “And Moses and Aaron took these men that are pointed out [ nikkevu ] by name” And prohibition from here: “You shall fear the Lord, your God”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Eima: Paroshei shemeih hu, dikhtiv: 'vayikakh Moshe ve'Aharon et ha'anashim ha'eleh asher nikbe'u beshemot'. Ve'azharteh mehakha: 'et Hashem Eloheikha tira'." English translation: "Say: He is one who explains his name, as it is written: 'And Moses and Aaron took these men who were designated by name'. And its warning is from here: 'You shall fear the Lord your God'."

hebrew_text: חֲדָא, דְּבָעֵינָא שֵׁם בְּשֵׁם וְלֵיכָּא. וְעוֹד, הָוְיָא לֵיהּ אַזְהָרַת עֲשֵׂה, וְאַזְהָרַת עֲשֵׂה לָא שְׁמַהּ אַזְהָרָה.
human_translation: One that necessary name with name and not Furthermore, is a prohibition a positive mitzva, and a prohibition a positive mitzva is not considered a prohibition.
llm_translation: One, that I seek a name in a name and it is not. And furthermore, there should be for him a warning of doing, and a warning of doing is not called a warning.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: אָמַר קְרָא ״וַיִּקֹּב... וַיְקַלֵּל״, לְמֵימְרָא דְּנוֹקֵב קְלָלָה הוּא.
human_translation: And if you wish, say the verse states: “And blasphemed [ vayyikkov ] and cursed” That is to say that nokev is curse.
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: The verse says, "And he struck... and he cursed," to say that one who strikes is also cursing.

hebrew_text: וְדִילְמָא עַד דְּעָבֵד תַּרְוַיְיהוּ? לָא סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ, דִּכְתִיב: ״הוֹצֵא אֶת הַמְקַלֵּל״, וְלָא כְּתִיב: ״הוֹצֵא אֶת הַנֹּקֵב וְהַמְקַלֵּל״. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ חֲדָא הִיא.
human_translation: But perhaps unless he does both, not enter your mind, as it is written: “Bring forth the one who cursed… and it is not written: Bring forth the nokev and one who cursed. Conclude from it it is one
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Perhaps until they both agree? It is not according to your opinion, as it is written: "Bring out the one who cursed," and it is not written: "Bring out the one who cursed and the one who struck." Learn from it that it is one case. English translation:

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״אִישׁ״ – מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״אִישׁ אִישׁ״? לְרַבּוֹת אֶת הַגּוֹיִם, שֶׁמּוּזְהָרִין עַל בִּרְכַּת הַשֵּׁם כְּיִשְׂרָאֵל. וְאֵינָן נֶהֱרָגִין אֶלָּא בְּסַיִיף, שֶׁכׇּל מִיתָה הָאֲמוּרָה בִּבְנֵי נֹחַ אֵינָהּ אֶלָּא בְּסַיִיף.
human_translation: The Sages taught One [ ish ] Why the verse state: “Anyone [ ish ish ]”? to include the gentiles, who are prohibited from blessing, the name like Jews And they are executed by the sword alone, as all death stated with regard to the descendants of Noah are by the sword alone.
llm_translation: The sages taught: "Man" - what does the Scripture teach by saying "man man"? To include the Gentiles, who are careful with the blessing of the Name like Israel. And they are not killed except by the sword, for any death mentioned for the descendants of Noah is only by the sword.

hebrew_text: וְהָא מֵהָכָא נָפְקָא? מֵהָתָם נָפְקָא: ״ה׳״ – זוֹ בִּרְכַּת הַשֵּׁם.
human_translation: But is this derived from here? it is derived from there: “The Lord,” this the blessing, of the name
llm_translation: And this, from here it is derived? From there it is derived: "Hashem" - this is the blessing of the Name.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק נַפָּחָא: לֹא נִצְרְכָא אֶלָּא לְרַבּוֹת אֶת הַכִּינּוּיִין, וְאַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר.
human_translation: Rav Yitzḥak Nappaḥa says: is necessary only to include the appellations and in accordance with of Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yitzchak Nappacha: It was necessary only to include the designations, and according to the opinion of Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: ״אִישׁ אִישׁ כִּי יְקַלֵּל אֱלֹהָיו וְנָשָׂא חֶטְאוֹ״ – מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר? וַהֲלֹא כְּבָר נֶאֱמַר: ״וְנֹקֵב שֵׁם ה׳ מוֹת יוּמָת״! לְפִי שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״וְנֹקֵב שֵׁם מוֹת יוּמָת״, יָכוֹל לֹא יְהֵא חַיָּיב אֶלָּא עַל שֵׁם הַמְיוּחָד בִּלְבַד? מִנַּיִין לְרַבּוֹת כָּל הַכִּינּוּיִין? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אִישׁ כִּי יְקַלֵּל אֱלֹהָיו״ – מִכׇּל מָקוֹם. דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר.
human_translation: As it is taught Why the verse state: “Anyone who curses his God shall bear his sin”? But isn’t it already stated: “And he who blasphemes the name of the Lord shall be put to death” since it is stated: “And he who blasphemes the name shall be put to death,” might will be liable only for the ineffable name From where includes any of the appellations The verse states: “Anyone who curses his God,” in any case. the statement of Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: "If a man curses his God, he shall bear his sin" - What is the Talmud coming to teach us? Has it not already been stated: "And he who blasphemes the name of the Lord shall surely be put to death"! Since it is stated "And he who blasphemes the name shall surely be put to death," one might have thought that one is liable only for the unique name alone? How do we know to include all forms of designation? The Talmud comes to teach us: "If a man curses his God" - from any place. These are the words of Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: עַל שֵׁם הַמְיוּחָד בְּמִיתָה, וְעַל הַכִּינּוּיִין בְּאַזְהָרָה.
human_translation: And the Rabbis say: For the ineffable name by death, and for the appellations, for a prohibition.
llm_translation: The sages say: concerning the unique name in death, and concerning the designations in warning.

hebrew_text: וּפְלִיגָא דְּרַבִּי מְיָישָׁא, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי מְיָישָׁא: בֶּן נֹחַ שֶׁבֵּירַךְ אֶת הַשֵּׁם בְּכִינּוּי, לְרַבָּנַן חַיָּיב.
human_translation: And disagrees with Rav Meyasha. As Rav Meyasha says: A descendant of Noah who blessed God by appellations is liable according to the Rabbis.
llm_translation: The dispute of Rabbi Meir, for Rabbi Meir said: A Noahide who curses the Name with a substitute, according to the Rabbis, is liable.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא? דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״כַּגֵּר כָּאֶזְרָח״. גֵּר וְאֶזְרָח הוּא דְּבָעֵינַן ״בְּנׇקְבוֹ שֵׁם״, אֲבָל גּוֹי – אֲפִילּוּ בְּכִינּוּי.
human_translation: What is the reason? because the verse states: “The convert as well as the homeborn, it is a convert or a homeborn that we require “When he blasphemes the name,” But a gentile even due to an appellation.
llm_translation: What is the reason? Because the verse says: "Like the native, like the stranger." We require both a stranger and a native to have "a name designation," but a gentile - even with a nickname.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי מֵאִיר, הַאי ״כַּגֵּר כָּאֶזְרָח״ מַאי עָבֵיד לֵיהּ? גֵּר וְאֶזְרָח בִּסְקִילָה, אֲבָל גּוֹי בְּסַיִיף. סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: הוֹאִיל וְאִיתְרַבּוֹ, אִיתְרַבּוֹ – קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: And what does Rabbi Meir do with this “The convert as well as the homeborn”? a convert or a homeborn by stoning but a gentile by the sword. enter your mind to say since are included they are included teaches us
llm_translation: Rabbi Meir: This "like the convert like the native" - what does he do with it? A convert and a native are punished by stoning, but a gentile is punished by the sword. Is it your opinion that I would say: Since they have multiplied, they have multiplied - this is what it implies to us.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יִצְחָק נַפָּחָא, אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבָּנַן, הַאי ״כַּגֵּר כָּאֶזְרָח״ מַאי עָבֵיד לֵיהּ? גֵּר וְאֶזְרָח הוּא דְּבָעֵינַן שֵׁם בְּשֵׁם, אֲבָל גּוֹי לָא בָּעֵינַן שֵׁם בְּשֵׁם.
human_translation: And what does Rav Yitzḥak Nappaḥa do with this “The convert as well as the homeborn,” according to of the Rabbis, it is a convert and a homeborn that we require a name by a name but a gentile, we do not require a name by a name
llm_translation: Rabbi Yitzchak Nappacha, the son of Rabbanan, this "like a convert like a native" what does it do to him? Convert and native is what we require name with name, but a gentile we do not require name with name.

hebrew_text: ״אִישׁ אִישׁ״ – לְמָה לִי? דִּיבְּרָה תוֹרָה כִלְשׁוֹן בְּנֵי אָדָם.
human_translation: Why do I “anyone the Torah spoke in the language of people.
llm_translation: "אִישׁ אִישׁ" - Why do I need it? The Torah spoke in the language of men.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: שֶׁבַע מִצְוֹת נִצְטַוּוּ בְּנֵי נֹחַ – דִּינִין, וּבִרְכַּת הַשֵּׁם, עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה, גִּילּוּי עֲרָיוֹת, וּשְׁפִיכוּת דָּמִים, וְגָזֵל, וְאֵבֶר מִן הַחַי.
human_translation: The Sages taught The descendants of Noah, were commanded seven mitzvot: judgment; and blessing, the name idol worship; forbidden sexual relations; and bloodshed; and robbery; and a limb from a living
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: Seven commandments were commanded to the sons of Noah - laws, blessing the Name, idolatry, forbidden sexual relations, murder, theft, and a limb torn from a living animal.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי חֲנַנְיָה בֶּן גַּמְלָא אוֹמֵר: אַף עַל הַדָּם מִן הַחַי. רַבִּי חִידְקָא אוֹמֵר: אַף עַל הַסֵּירוּס. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: אַף עַל הַכִּישּׁוּף.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥananya ben Gamla says: also concerning the blood from a living Rabbi Ḥideka says: also concerning castration, Rabbi Shimon says: also concerning sorcery.
llm_translation: Rabbi Chananya ben Gamla says: Even on the blood of the living. Rabbi Chidka says: Even on the potsherd. Rabbi Shimon says: Even on the witchcraft.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: כׇּל הָאָמוּר בְּפָרָשַׁת כִּישּׁוּף – בֶּן נֹחַ מוּזְהָר עָלָיו. ״לֹא יִמָּצֵא בְךָ מַעֲבִיר בְּנוֹ וּבִתּוֹ בָּאֵשׁ קֹסֵם קְסָמִים מְעוֹנֵן וּמְנַחֵשׁ וּמְכַשֵּׁף. וְחֹבֵר חָבֶר וְשֹׁאֵל אוֹב וְיִדְּעֹנִי וְדֹרֵשׁ אֶל הַמֵּתִים וְגוֹ׳. וּבִגְלַל הַתּוֹעֵבֹת הָאֵלֶּה ה׳ אֱלֹהֶיךָ מוֹרִישׁ אוֹתָם מִפָּנֶיךָ״. וְלֹא עָנַשׁ אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן הִזְהִיר.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: every that is stated in the passage about sorcery, prohibited for a descendant of Noah to it. There shall not be found among you one who makes his son or his daughter pass through the fire, a diviner, a soothsayer, or an enchanter, or a warlock, or a charmer, or one who consults a necromancer and a sorcerer, or directs inquiries to the dead. and because of these abominations, the Lord your God is driving them out from before you” and would not have punished unless He prohibited
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: Everything stated in the portion of witchcraft - a Ben Noach should be cautious about it. "There shall not be found among you anyone who passes his son or daughter through fire, a soothsayer, a diviner of times, an enchanter, a witch, one who consults a ghost or familiar spirit, or one who inquires of the dead." And because of these abominations, the Lord your God is driving them out from before you. And He only punished if one was warned.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: אַף עַל הַכִּלְאַיִם. מוּתָּרִין בְּנֵי נֹחַ לִלְבּוֹשׁ כִּלְאַיִם וְלִזְרוֹעַ כִּלְאַיִם, וְאֵין אֲסוּרִין אֶלָּא בְּהַרְבָּעַת בְּהֵמָה וּבְהַרְכָּבַת הָאִילָן.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar says: also concerning diverse kinds. permitted for the descendants of Noah to wear diverse kinds and to sow diverse kinds and they are prohibited only with regard to breeding animals and grafting trees.
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar says: Even regarding kilayim, the sons of Noah are permitted to wear kilayim garments and to sow kilayim, and they are only prohibited in the mixture of diverse kinds in the plowing of an animal and in grafting a tree.

hebrew_text: מְנָהָנֵי מִילֵּי? אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: דְּאָמַר קְרָא, ״וַיְצַו ה׳ אֱלֹהִים עַל הָאָדָם לֵאמֹר מִכֹּל עֵץ הַגָּן אָכֹל תֹּאכֵל״.
human_translation: From where are these matters, Rabbi Yoḥanan says: which the verse states: “And the Lord God commanded the man, saying: Of every tree of the garden you may freely eat;
llm_translation: Talmudic text: What are these words? Rabbi Yochanan said: As the verse says, "And the Lord God commanded the man, saying, 'Of every tree of the garden you may freely eat.'"

hebrew_text: ״וַיְצַו״ – אֵלּוּ הַדִּינִין, וְכֵן הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״כִּי יְדַעְתִּיו לְמַעַן אֲשֶׁר יְצַוֶּה אֶת בָּנָיו וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: “and…commanded,” these are the judgment; and so it states “For I have known him, to the end that he may command his children
llm_translation: "וַיְצַו" - These are the laws, and similarly it says: "For I have known him, to the end that he may command his children, etc."

hebrew_text: ״ה׳״ – זוֹ בִּרְכַּת הַשֵּׁם, וְכֵן הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״וְנֹקֵב שֵׁם ה׳ מוֹת יוּמָת״. ״אֱלֹהִים״ – זוֹ עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה, וְכֵן הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״לֹא יִהְיֶה לְךָ אֱלֹהִים אֲחֵרִים״. ״עַל הָאָדָם״ – זוֹ שְׁפִיכוּת דָּמִים, וְכֵן הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״שֹׁפֵךְ דַּם הָאָדָם וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: “the Lord,” this blessing the name and so it states “And he who blasphemes the name of the Lord…shall be put to death” “God,” this idol worship; and so it states: “You shall have no other gods “The man,” this bloodshed; and so it states: “One who sheds the blood of man,
llm_translation: "The Lord" - this is the blessing of the Name, as it says: "And one who blasphemes the name of the Lord shall surely be put to death." "Elohim" - this is idolatry, as it says: "You shall have no other gods before Me." "Upon man" - this is shedding of blood, as it says: "Whoever sheds the blood of man, by man shall his blood be shed."

hebrew_text: ״לֵאמֹר״ – זוֹ גִּילּוּי עֲרָיוֹת, וְכֵן הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״לֵאמֹר הֵן יְשַׁלַּח אִישׁ אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ וְהָלְכָה מֵאִתּוֹ וְהָיְתָה לְאִישׁ אַחֵר״. ״מִכֹּל עֵץ הַגָּן״ – וְלֹא גָּזֵל. ״אָכֹל תֹּאכֵל״ – וְלֹא אֵבֶר מִן הַחַי.
human_translation: “saying,” this forbidden sexual relations; and so it states: “Saying, if a man sends his wife, and she goes from him and becomes another man’s… “Of every tree of the garden” and not stolen items. “You may freely eat” but not a limb from a living
llm_translation: "To say" - this is a revelation of forbidden relationships, as it also says: "To say, 'If a man sends his wife away, and she goes from him and becomes another man's.'" "From every tree of the garden" - not theft. "You may eat" - and not a limb from a living animal.

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא רַבִּי יִצְחָק, תָּנֵי אִיפְּכָא: ״וַיְצַו״ – זוֹ עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה, ״אֱלֹהִים״ – זוֹ דִּינִין.
human_translation: When Rav Yitzḥak came he taught the opposite “And…commanded,” this idol worship. “God,” this judgment.
llm_translation: When Rabbi Yitzchak came, he taught the reverse: "And He commanded" - this refers to idolatry, "God" - this refers to judgments.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא ״אֱלֹהִים״ – זוֹ דִּינִין, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְנִקְרַב בַּעַל הַבַּיִת אֶל הָאֱלֹהִים״. אֶלָּא ״וַיְצַו״ – זוֹ עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה, מַאי מַשְׁמַע?
human_translation: Granted, “God [ Elohim ],” this judgment, as it is written: “Then the master of the house shall come near the judges [ ha’elohim ]” But “And…commanded,” this idol worship, from where inferred?
llm_translation: In peace, "Elohim" - this is judgments, as it is written: "And the master of the house shall come near to the Elohim." Rather, "And he commanded" - this is idolatry, what does it imply?

hebrew_text: רַב חִסְדָּא וְרַב יִצְחָק בַּר אַבְדִּימִי: חַד אָמַר, ״סָרוּ מַהֵר מִן הַדֶּרֶךְ אֲשֶׁר צִוִּיתִם עָשׂוּ לָהֶם וְגוֹ׳״, וְחַד אָמַר, ״עָשׁוּק אֶפְרַיִם רְצוּץ מִשְׁפָּט כִּי הוֹאִיל הָלַךְ אַחֲרֵי צָו״.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda and Rav Yitzḥak bar Avdimi One says “They have turned aside quickly out of the way that I commanded them; they have made them And one says “Ephraim is oppressed, crushed in justice, because he willingly went after filth [ tzav ]”
llm_translation: Rav Chisda and Rav Yitzchak bar Avdimi: One said, "They quickly turned aside from the way that I commanded them, etc.," and one said, "Ephraim is oppressed, crushed in judgment, for he willingly walked after the command."

hebrew_text: מַאי בֵּינַיְיהוּ? אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ: גּוֹי שֶׁעָשָׂה עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה וְלֹא הִשְׁתַּחֲוָה לָהּ. לְמַאן דְּאָמַר ״עָשׂוּ״ – מִשְּׁעַת עֲשִׂיָּיה מְחַיֵּיב. לְמַאן דְּאָמַר ״כִּי הוֹאִיל הָלַךְ״ – עַד דְּאָזֵיל בָּתְרַהּ וּפָלַח לַהּ.
human_translation: What is between between a gentile who fashioned an idol but did not bow to it, According to the one who says “They have made he is rendered liable from the time of fashioning According to the one who says “Because he willingly went until he goes after it and worships it.
llm_translation: What is the difference between them? There is a difference between them: a non-Jew who performed idol worship and did not prostrate himself to it. According to the one who says "they did" - from the moment they did, he is liable. According to the one who says "when he went willingly" - until he goes after it and prostrates himself to it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: וּמִי אִיכָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר גּוֹי שֶׁעָשָׂה עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה וְלֹא הִשְׁתַּחֲוָה לָהּ – חַיָּיב? וְהָתַנְיָא: בַּעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה, דְּבָרִים שֶׁבֵּית דִּין שֶׁל יִשְׂרָאֵל מְמִיתִין עֲלֵיהֶן – בֶּן נֹחַ מוּזְהָר עֲלֵיהֶן; אֵין בֵּית דִּין שֶׁל יִשְׂרָאֵל מְמִיתִין עֲלֵיהֶן – אֵין בֶּן נֹחַ מוּזְהָר עֲלֵיהֶן. לְמַעוֹטֵי מַאי? לָאו לְמַעוֹטֵי גּוֹי שֶׁעָשָׂה עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה וְלֹא הִשְׁתַּחֲוָה לָהּ?
human_translation: Rava says: And is there anyone who says a gentile who fashioned an idol but did not bow to it is liable? But isn’t it taught With regard to idol worship, matters, for which a Jewish court executes are prohibited to a descendant of Noah. for which a Jewish court does not execute a descendant of Noah is not prohibited from them. To exclude what not to exclude a gentile who fashioned an idol but did not bow to it?
llm_translation: Rava said: And who is there according to the one who said that a non-Jew who performed idol worship but did not prostrate himself to it is liable? And it was taught in a baraita: In the case of idol worship, matters for which the Jewish court imposes the death penalty – a Noahide is warned about them; matters for which the Jewish court does not impose the death penalty – a Noahide is not warned about them. What is the exclusionary principle? Is it not to exclude a non-Jew who performed idol worship but did not prostrate himself to it?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: לָא, לְמַעוֹטֵי גִּיפּוּף וְנִישּׁוּק.
human_translation: Rav Pappa says: No, to exclude embracing and kissing
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: No, to exclude the case of a slap and a kiss.

hebrew_text: גִּיפּוּף וְנִישּׁוּק דְּמַאי? אִילֵּימָא כְּדַרְכָּהּ – בַּר קְטָלָא הוּא! אֶלָּא, לְמַעוֹטֵי שֶׁלֹּא כְּדַרְכָּהּ.
human_translation: Embracing and kissing in what If we say in its manner he is liable to death Rather, to exclude where not in its manner
llm_translation: "Gifuf and Nishuk, what are they? If you say in its usual manner - it is a form of killing! Rather, to exclude cases that are not in its usual manner."

hebrew_text: דִּינִין בְּנֵי נֹחַ אִיפְּקוּד? וְהָתַנְיָא: עֶשֶׂר מִצְוֹת נִצְטַוּוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל בְּמָרָה, שֶׁבַע שֶׁקִּיבְּלוּ עֲלֵיהֶן בְּנֵי נֹחַ, וְהוֹסִיפוּ עֲלֵיהֶן דִּינִין וְשַׁבָּת וְכִיבּוּד אָב וָאֵם.
human_translation: Were the descendants of Noah commanded judgment? But isn’t it taught The Jewish people were commanded ten mitzvot in Marah: Seven that the descendants of Noah accepted upon themselves, and added to them Judgment, and Shabbat, and honoring father and mother.
llm_translation: Laws of the Sons of Noah, what are they? And it was taught: Ten commandments were commanded to Israel at Marah, seven that the Sons of Noah accepted upon themselves, and they added to them laws, Sabbath, and honoring father and mother.

hebrew_text: דִּינִין, דִּכְתִיב: ״שָׁם שָׂם לוֹ חֹק וּמִשְׁפָּט״. שַׁבָּת וְכִיבּוּד אָב וָאֵם, דִּכְתִיב: ״כַּאֲשֶׁר צִוְּךָ ה׳ אֱלֹהֶיךָ״. וְאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: ״כַּאֲשֶׁר צִוְּךָ״ – בְּמָרָה.
human_translation: judgment as it is written “There He made for them a statute and an ordinance” Shabbat and honoring father and mother as it is written as the Lord your God commanded you” And Rav Yehuda says: “As commanded you” in Marah.
llm_translation: Laws, as it is written: "There He set for them a statute and a judgment." Shabbat, honoring father and mother, as it is written: "As the Lord your God has commanded you." And Rav Yehudah said: "As He has commanded you" - with bitterness.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ: לֹא נִצְרְכָה אֶלָּא לָעֵדָה, וְעֵדִים, וְהַתְרָאָה.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman says Rabba bar Avuh says: was necessary only with regard to Sanhedrin, and witnesses and a forewarning
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said, Rabba bar Avuh said: It was only needed for testimony, witnesses, and warning.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, מַאי ״וְהוֹסִיפוּ עֲלֵיהֶן דִּינִין״?
human_translation: If so, what And added to them: Judgment?
llm_translation: "If so, what is the meaning of 'and add laws upon them'?"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: לֹא נִצְרְכָה אֶלָּא לְדִינֵי קְנָסוֹת. אַכַּתִּי, ״וְהוֹסִיפוּ בְּדִינִין״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ!
human_translation: Rather, Rava says: was necessary only with regard to the halakhot of fines. still it should have And added to them of judgment.
llm_translation: Rava said: It was only necessary for cases of penalties. But, "And they shall add to the judgment," what does he require from it!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב: לֹא נִצְרְכָה אֶלָּא לְהוֹשִׁיב בֵּית דִּין בְּכׇל פֶּלֶךְ וָפֶלֶךְ, וּבְכׇל עִיר וָעִיר. וְהָא בְּנֵי נֹחַ לָא אִיפְּקוּד? וְהָתַנְיָא: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁנִּצְטַוּוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל לְהוֹשִׁיב בָּתֵּי דִינִין בְּכׇל פֶּלֶךְ וָפֶלֶךְ וּבְכׇל עִיר וָעִיר, כָּךְ נִצְטַוּוּ בְּנֵי נֹחַ לְהוֹשִׁיב בָּתֵּי דִינִין בְּכׇל פֶּלֶךְ וָפֶלֶךְ וּבְכׇל עִיר וָעִיר.
human_translation: Rather, Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov says: It was necessary only to establish a court in each and every province and in each and every city. And were the descendants of Noah not commanded this But isn’t it taught Just as the Jewish people were commanded to establish courts in each and every province and in each and every city, so too, the descendants of Noah were commanded to establish courts in each and every province and in each and every city?
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov said: It was only necessary to establish a court in every district and in every city. But did the descendants of Noah not have an obligation? But it was taught: Just as the Israelites were commanded to establish courts in every district and in every city, so too were the descendants of Noah commanded to establish courts in every district and in every city.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: הַאי תַּנָּא תַּנָּא דְבֵי מְנַשֶּׁה הוּא, דְּמַפֵּיק דַּ״ךְ וְעָיֵיל סַ״ךְ.
human_translation: Rather, Rava says: This tanna , is tanna of the school of Menashe, who removes dalet , kaf , and inserts samekh , kaf ,
llm_translation: Rava said: This Mishna was taught in the school of Menashe, that one may take out a "dalet" and bring in a "samech."

hebrew_text: דְּתַנָּא דְבֵי מְנַשֶּׁה: שֶׁבַע מִצְוֹת נִצְטַוּוּ בְּנֵי נֹחַ – עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה, וְגִילּוּי עֲרָיוֹת, וּשְׁפִיכוּת דָּמִים, גָּזֵל, וְאֵבֶר מִן הַחַי, סֵירוּס, וְכִלְאַיִם.
human_translation: As the school of Menashe taught: The descendants of Noah were commanded seven mitzvot: idol worship, and forbidden sexual relations, and bloodshed, robbery, and a limb from a living castration, and diverse kinds.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: D'tanna d'bei Menashe: Sheva mitzvot nitztavu bnei Noach - Avodah zarah, v'gilu'i arayot, u'sh'fichut damim, gazel, v'ever min hachai, seirus, v'kilayim. English translation: It was taught in the school of Menashe: Seven commandments were commanded to the descendants of Noah - idolatry, forbidden sexual relations, murder, theft, eating a limb from a living animal, blasphemy, and forbidden mixtures.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אָדָם הָרִאשׁוֹן לֹא נִצְטַוָּוה אֶלָּא עַל עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה בִּלְבַד, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״וַיְצַו ה׳ אֱלֹהִים עַל הָאָדָם״. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בְּתִירָה אוֹמֵר: אַף עַל בִּרְכַּת הַשֵּׁם. וְיֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים: אַף עַל הַדִּינִים.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: Adam, the first was commanded only with regard to idol worship, as it is stated: “And the Lord God commanded the man” Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira says: also concerning blessing the name And some say also concerning judgment.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: Adam the first was commanded only regarding foreign worship, as it says, "And the Lord God commanded upon the man." Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira says: Even regarding the blessing of the Name. And some say: Even regarding judgments.

hebrew_text: כְּמַאן אָזְלָא הָא דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: ״אֱלֹהִים אֲנִי״ – לֹא תְּקַלְּלוּנִי, ״אֱלֹהִים אֲנִי״ – לֹא תְּמִירוּנִי, ״אֱלֹהִים אֲנִי״ – יְהֵא מוֹרָאִי עֲלֵיכֶם? כְּמַאן? כְּיֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים.
human_translation: In accordance with whose is that which Rav Yehuda says Rav says, I am “God,” do not curse Me; I am “God,” do not exchange Me I am “God,” My fear shall be upon you? In accordance with whose in accordance with some say,
llm_translation: As to where did he go? This one that Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: "I am God" - do not curse me, "I am God" - do not exchange me, "I am God" - should my fear be upon you? As to where? Like someone who says.

hebrew_text: וְתַנָּא דְבֵי מְנַשֶּׁה: אִי דָּרֵישׁ ״וַיְצַו״ – אֲפִילּוּ הָנָךְ נָמֵי, אִי לָא דָּרֵישׁ ״וַיְצַו״ – הָנֵי מְנָא לֵיהּ?
human_translation: If tanna of the school of Menashe interprets “and commanded” homiletically, even these if he does not interpret “and commanded” homiletically, from where does he these
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it was taught in the school of Menashe: If one interprets "And he commanded" - even if he is silent, if one does not interpret "And he commanded" - how do they count it?

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם לָא דָּרֵישׁ ״וַיְצַו״. הָנֵי, כֹּל חֲדָא וַחֲדָא בְּאַפֵּי נַפְשַׁהּ כְּתִיבָא: עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה וְגִילּוּי עֲרָיוֹת -
human_translation: Actually, he does not interpret “and commanded” homiletically, these each and every one is written separately idol worship and forbidden sexual relations
llm_translation: Always one should not expound "and He commanded." These, each and every one by itself it is written: idolatry and forbidden relationships -

hebrew_text: דִּכְתִיב: ״וַתִּשָּׁחֵת הָאָרֶץ לִפְנֵי הָאֱלֹהִים״. וְתָנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: בְּכׇל מָקוֹם שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר הַשְׁחָתָה, אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא דְּבַר עֶרְוָה וַעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה. דָּבָר עֶרְוָה – שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי הִשְׁחִית כׇּל בָּשָׂר אֶת דַּרְכּוֹ״. עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה – דִּכְתִיב: ״פֶּן תַּשְׁחִתוּן וַעֲשִׂיתֶם וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: as it is written: “And the earth was corrupt before God” and the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: Anywhere that corruption is stated, it is nothing other than a matter of licentiousness and idol worship. a matter of licentiousness, as it is stated: “For all flesh had corrupted their way And idol worship, as it is written: “Lest you deal corruptly, and make
llm_translation: Talmudic text: It is written: "And the earth was corrupt before God." And it was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael: In every place where corruption is mentioned, it refers only to forbidden sexual relations and idolatry. Forbidden sexual relations - as it is written: "For all flesh had corrupted its way." Idolatry - as it is written: "Lest you act corruptly and make for yourselves..."

hebrew_text: וְאִידָּךְ, אוֹרְחַיְיהוּ דְּקָא מְגַלֵּי.
human_translation: And the other exposes the behavior of
llm_translation: And the other, their ways that they reveal.

hebrew_text: שְׁפִיכוּת דָּמִים, דִּכְתִיב: ״שֹׁפֵךְ דַּם הָאָדָם וְגוֹ׳״. וְאִידַּךְ? קְטָלַיְיהוּ הוּא דְּקָמְגַלֵּי.
human_translation: bloodshed as it is written: “One who sheds the blood of man, And the other reveals death
llm_translation: The shedding of blood, as it is written: "Whoever sheds the blood of man, etc." And the other opinion? It is he who reveals.

hebrew_text: גָּזֵל, דִּכְתִיב: ״כְּיֶרֶק עֵשֶׂב נָתַתִּי לָכֶם אֶת כֹּל״. וְאָמַר רַבִּי לֵוִי: כְּיֶרֶק עֵשֶׂב, וְלֹא כְּיֶרֶק גִּנָּה. וְאִידַּךְ? הָהוּא לְמִישְׁרֵי בָּשָׂר הוּא דַּאֲתָא.
human_translation: robbery as it is written: like the green herbs I have given you all” And Rabbi Levi says: Like the green herbs and not like the vegetation of a garden, And the other that comes to permit meat.
llm_translation: Theft, as it is written: "Like the green herb, I have given you everything." And Rabbi Levi said: Like the green herb, and not like the green of a garden. And the other opinion? That refers to the straightness of meat that comes.

hebrew_text: אֵבֶר מִן הַחַי, דִּכְתִיב: ״אַךְ בָּשָׂר בְּנַפְשׁוֹ דָמוֹ לֹא תֹאכֵלוּ״. וְאִידַּךְ? הָהוּא לְמִישְׁרֵי שְׁרָצִים הוּא דַּאֲתָא.
human_translation: a limb from a living as it is written: “Only flesh with its life, which is its blood, you shall not eat” And the other that comes to permit creeping animals;
llm_translation: Limb from a living animal, as it is written: "Only flesh with its life, its blood, you shall not eat." And the other? That one is for the straight ones of creeping things that came.

hebrew_text: סֵירוּס, דִּכְתִיב: ״שִׁרְצוּ בָאָרֶץ וּרְבוּ בָהּ״. וְאִידַּךְ? לִבְרָכָה בְּעָלְמָא.
human_translation: castration as it is written: swarm in the earth and multiply in it” And the other merely as a blessing,
llm_translation: Sirus, as it is written: "Swarm in the land and multiply in it." And the other opinion? It is for a blessing in the world.

hebrew_text: כִּלְאַיִם, דִּכְתִיב: ״מֵהָעוֹף לְמִינֵהוּ״. וְאִידַּךְ? הָהוּא לְצַוְתָּא בְּעָלְמָא.
human_translation: diverse kinds as it is written: “Of the fowl after their kind And the other that merely for companionship,
llm_translation: Biklaim, dikhtiv: "Me'ha'of leminehu." Ve'idach? Hahu letzavta be'alma.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: אָמְרִי בֵּי רַב, עַל שָׁלֹשׁ מִצְוֹת בֶּן נֹחַ נֶהֱרָג (גֶּשֶׁר סִימָן) – עַל גִּילּוּי עֲרָיוֹת, וְעַל שְׁפִיכוּת דָּמִים, וְעַל בִּרְכַּת הַשֵּׁם.
human_translation: Rav Yosef says: They say study hall a descendant of Noah is executed for three mitzvot, gimmel , shin , reish a mnemonic For forbidden sexual relations, for bloodshed, and for blessing, the name
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: The sages of the house of Rav say, regarding three commandments, a Ben Noach is liable to be killed (Gesher Siman) - for illicit relations, for murder, and for blasphemy of the Name.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: בִּשְׁלָמָא שְׁפִיכוּת דָּמִים, דִּכְתִיב ״שֹׁפֵךְ דַּם הָאָדָם וְגוֹ׳״, אֶלָּא הָנָךְ מְנָא לְהוּ?
human_translation: Rav Sheshet objects to this Granted, bloodshed, as it is written: “One who sheds the blood of man, But those from where do
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates as follows: Rav Sheshet objects to her: With regard to the shedding of blood, for it is written, "Whoever sheds the blood of man, etc." But where do you find this?

hebrew_text: אִי גָּמַר מִשְּׁפִיכוּת דָּמִים, אֲפִילּוּ כּוּלְּהוּ נָמֵי. אִי מִשּׁוּם דְּאִיתְרַבַּאי מֵ״אִישׁ אִישׁ״, עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה נָמֵי אִיתְרַבַּי מֵ״אִישׁ אִישׁ״.
human_translation: If derive from bloodshed even any of If because they are included in “anyone” idol worship too, they are included in “anyone”
llm_translation: If he completed the sprinkling of the blood, even all of them are valid. If it is because it is repeated "man by man," the foreign service is repeated "man by man."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: אָמְרִי בֵּי רַב, עַל אַרְבַּע מִצְוֹת בֶּן נֹחַ נֶהֱרָג.
human_translation: Rather, Rav Sheshet says they say study hall: A descendant of Noah is executed for four mitzvot;
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Sheshet said: The students of Rav said, regarding the four commandments of a Ben Noach, he is liable to be killed.

hebrew_text: וְעַל עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה בֶּן נֹחַ נֶהֱרָג? וְהָתַנְיָא: בַּעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה, דְּבָרִים שֶׁבֵּית דִּין שֶׁל יִשְׂרָאֵל מְמִיתִין עֲלֵיהֶן – בֶּן נֹחַ מוּזְהָר עֲלֵיהֶן. אַזְהָרָה – אִין, מִיתָה – לָא! אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: אַזְהָרָה שֶׁלָּהֶן – זוֹ הִיא מִיתָתָן.
human_translation: And is a descendant of Noah executed for idol worship? But isn’t it taught With regard to idol worship, matters for which a Jewish court executes are prohibited to a descendant of Noah. Yes, a prohibition no death Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak says: Their prohibition is their death
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And regarding idol worship, is a Ben Noach killed? And it was taught: In the case of idol worship, matters for which the Jewish court executes, a Ben Noach is cautioned about them. Caution - yes, death penalty - no! Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: Their caution is their death penalty. English translation:

hebrew_text: רַב הוּנָא וְרַב יְהוּדָה וְכוּלְּהוּ תַּלְמִידֵי דְּרַב אָמְרִי: עַל שֶׁבַע מִצְוֹת בֶּן נֹחַ נֶהֱרָג. גַּלִּי רַחֲמָנָא בַּחֲדָא, וְהוּא הַדִּין לְכוּלְּהוּ.
human_translation: Rav Huna, Rav Yehuda, and all of the students of Rav say: A descendant of Noah is executed for seven mitzvot; the Merciful One revealed with regard to one and the same is true with regard to all of them.
llm_translation: Rav Huna and Rav Yehudah and all the students of Rav said: Regarding the seven Noahide commandments, one is liable to be killed. The Merciful One revealed this in one place, and it is the same for all of them.

hebrew_text: וְעַל הַגָּזֵל בֶּן נֹחַ נֶהֱרָג? וְהָתַנְיָא: עַל הַגָּזֵל, גָּנַב וְגָזַל, וְכֵן יְפַת תּוֹאַר, וְכֵן כַּיּוֹצֵא בָּהֶן – גּוֹי בְּגוֹי וְגוֹי בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל אָסוּר, וְיִשְׂרָאֵל בְּגוֹי מוּתָּר. וְאִם אִיתָא, נִיתְנֵי ״חַיָּיב״!
human_translation: But is a descendant of Noah executed for robbery? But isn’t it taught With regard to robbery: steals or robs, and likewise beautiful woman and likewise similar to these, a gentile to gentile, or a gentile to a Jew, prohibited; but a Jew to a gentile, it is permitted? And if it is so let teach liable
llm_translation: And on the theft, a Ben Noach is killed? And it was taught: On the theft, stealing and robbery, and likewise beauty, and likewise similar to them - a non-Jew with a non-Jew and a non-Jew with a Jew is forbidden, and a Jew with a non-Jew is permitted. And if it comes, it is given "liable"!

hebrew_text: מִשּׁוּם דְּקָבָעֵי לְמִיתְנֵי סֵיפָא: ״יִשְׂרָאֵל בְּגוֹי מוּתָּר״, תְּנָא רֵישָׁא: ״אָסוּר״.
human_translation: Because wanted to teach the latter clause a Jew to a gentile, it is permitted, he taught the former clause it is prohibited.
llm_translation: Due to the fact that they established to teach the latter part: "A Jew among gentiles is permitted," a Tanna in the beginning teaches: "It is forbidden."

hebrew_text: וְהָא כֹּל הֵיכָא דְּאִית לֵיהּ חִיּוּבָא מִיתְנָא קָתָנֵי, דְּקָתָנֵי רֵישָׁא: עַל שְׁפִיכוּת דָּמִים – גּוֹי בְּגוֹי וְגוֹי בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל חַיָּיב, יִשְׂרָאֵל בְּגוֹי פָּטוּר.
human_translation: But wherever there is liability teaches as it is taught the first clause: With regard to bloodshed, a gentile gentile, or a gentile a Jew, liable. a Jew a gentile, exempt.
llm_translation: And this, wherever there is an obligation, it is taught in the Mishnah, as it is taught in the beginning: "For the shedding of blood - a gentile with a gentile and a gentile with an Israelite is liable, an Israelite with a gentile is exempt."

hebrew_text: הָתָם, הֵיכִי לִיתְנֵי? לִיתְנֵי ״אָסוּר״ וּ״מוּתָּר״? וְהָתַנְיָא: גּוֹי, וְרוֹעֵי בְּהֵמָה דַּקָּה – לֹא מַעֲלִין וְלֹא מוֹרִידִין.
human_translation: There, how should teach Should he teach prohibited and permitted, But isn’t it taught a gentile, and shepherds of small livestock, one may not raise and one may not lower
llm_translation: There, how should it be taught? Should it be taught as "forbidden" and "permitted"? But it was taught: A non-Jew and one who grazes small cattle - we do not promote them nor do we demote them.

hebrew_text: כַּיּוֹצֵא בּוֹ בְּגָזֵל, מַאי הִיא? אָמַר רַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב: לֹא נִצְרְכָה אֶלָּא לְפוֹעֵל בַּכֶּרֶם.
human_translation: With regard to robbery, what similar to it is Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov says: It is necessary only to a laborer in a vineyard
llm_translation: As it is similar in the case of theft, what is it? Rav Acha bar Yaakov said: It is only necessary for the worker in the vineyard.

hebrew_text: פּוֹעֵל בַּכֶּרֶם אֵימַת? אִי בִּשְׁעַת גְּמַר מְלָאכָה – הֶתֵּירָא הוּא, אִי לָאו בִּשְׁעַת גְּמַר מְלָאכָה – גָּזֵל מְעַלְּיָא הוּא.
human_translation: When laborer in a vineyard If at the time of the completion of work, it is permitted If it is not at the time of the completion of work, is full-fledged robbery,
llm_translation: Worker in the vineyard when? If at the time of completion of work - it is permitted, if not at the time of completion of work - it is considered theft.
