hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: לֹא נִצְרְכָה אֶלָּא לְפָחוֹת מִשָּׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה. אִי הָכִי, גּוֹי בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל אָסוּר? הָא בַּר מְחִילָה הוּא! נְהִי דְּבָתַר הָכִי מָחֵיל לֵיהּ, צַעֲרָא בְּשַׁעְתֵּיהּ מִי לֵית לֵיהּ?
human_translation: Rather, Rav Pappa says is necessary only to less than the value of one peruta . If so, prohibited a gentile to a Jew? Isn’t apt to forgive Although afterward forgives him, does he not incur distress at the time of
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Papa said: It is necessary only for less than the value of a perutah. If so, is a non-Jew forbidden to a Jew? He is a descendant of Bar Mechilah! Even though he is thus lenient towards him, does he not cause him distress at that time?

hebrew_text: גּוֹי בְּגוֹי כַּיּוֹצֵא בָּהֶן, כֵּיוָן דְּלָאו בְּנֵי מְחִילָה נִינְהוּ – גָּזֵל מְעַלְּיָא הוּא.
human_translation: similar to a gentile a gentile? Since they are not apt to forgiveness, is full-fledged robbery,
llm_translation: Nation in nation like them, since not in sons of valor they are - robbery from above it is.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, אָמַר רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִיקָא: לֹא נִצְרְכָה אֶלָּא לְכוֹבֵשׁ שְׂכַר שָׂכִיר. גּוֹי בְּגוֹי וְגוֹי בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל – אָסוּר; יִשְׂרָאֵל בְּגוֹי – מוּתָּר.
human_translation: Rather, Rav Aḥa, son of Rav Ika, says It is necessary only to withholds the wages of a hired laborer; a gentile to gentile and a gentile to a Jew is prohibited, a Jew to a gentile is permitted.
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Ahah son of Rav Ika said: It was necessary only for a hired laborer to collect his wages. A non-Jew with a non-Jew and a non-Jew with a Jew - it is prohibited; a Jew with a non-Jew - it is permitted.

hebrew_text: כַּיּוֹצֵא בִּיפַת תּוֹאַר, מַאי הִיא? כִּי אֲתָא רַב דִּימִי, אָמַר: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: בֶּן נֹחַ שֶׁיִּיחֵד שִׁפְחָה לְעַבְדּוֹ וּבָא עָלֶיהָ – נֶהֱרָג עָלֶיהָ.
human_translation: What is similar to a beautiful woman When Rav Dimi came Rabbi Elazar says Rabbi Ḥanina says: a descendant of Noah who designated a maidservant for his slave, and engaged in intercourse with her, he is executed on her account.
llm_translation: As an expert Talmud scholar, I will now provide the English translation of the given Talmudic text: Talmudic text: "As in the case of the beauty of appearance, what is it? When Rav Dimi came, he said: Rabbi Elazar said Rabbi Chanina: A Noachide who unites a maidservant to his slave and has relations with her - he is liable to be put to death." English translation:

hebrew_text: כַּיּוֹצֵא בּוֹ דִּשְׁפִיכוּת דָּמִים לָא תַּנְיָא. אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: אִי מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן בֶּן שָׁאוּל הִיא. דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן בֶּן שָׁאוּל אוֹמֵר: רוֹדֵף אַחַר חֲבֵירוֹ לְהוֹרְגוֹ, וְיָכוֹל לְהַצִּילוֹ בְּאֶחָד מֵאֵבָרָיו וְלֹא הִצִּיל -
human_translation: does not teach similar to bloodshed. Abaye says: If you find that teaches it is Rabbi Yonatan ben Shaul. As it is taught Rabbi Yonatan ben Shaul says: pursues another to kill him, and can save himself by one of the limbs of but he does not save
llm_translation: As an example of this, regarding the shedding of blood, it is not taught. Abaye said: If you forget that it is taught, it is Rabbi Yonatan ben Sha'ul. It is taught, Rabbi Yonatan ben Sha'ul says: One may pursue after his fellow to kill him, and he may save him by injuring one of his limbs, but he did not save him -

hebrew_text: נֶהֱרָג עָלָיו.
human_translation: is executed for him
llm_translation: He was killed upon him.

hebrew_text: אַשְׁכַּח רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב בַּר אַחָא דַּהֲוָה כְּתִיב בְּסֵפֶר אַגַּדְתָּא דְּבֵי רַב: בֶּן נֹחַ נֶהֱרָג בְּדַיָּין אֶחָד, וּבְעֵד אֶחָד, שֶׁלֹּא בְּהַתְרָאָה, מִפִּי אִישׁ וְלֹא מִפִּי אִשָּׁה, וַאֲפִילּוּ קָרוֹב. מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל אָמְרוּ: אַף עַל הָעוּבָּרִין.
human_translation: Rabbi Ya’akov bar Aḥa found that it was written in a book of Aggadot in the study hall of Rav: a descendant of Noah is executed on the basis of one judge, and by one witness, without forewarning by the mouth of a man and not by the mouth of a woman; but even a relative said in the name of Rabbi Yishmael even for fetuses.
llm_translation: I found Rabbi Yaakov bar Acha who was written in the book of Aggadata of the house of Rav: A non-Jew is executed by one judge, and by one witness, not by testimony given simultaneously, from the mouth of a man and not from the mouth of a woman, even if they are relatives. In the name of Rabbi Yishmael they said: Even regarding fetuses.

hebrew_text: מְנָהָנֵי מִילֵּי? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: דְּאָמַר קְרָא, ״אַךְ אֶת דִּמְכֶם לְנַפְשֹׁתֵיכֶם אֶדְרֹשׁ״, אֲפִילּוּ בְּדַיָּין אֶחָד.
human_translation: From where are these matters Rav Yehuda says: which the verse states: your blood of your lives I will require; on the basis even one judge.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: What are the consequences? Rav Yehudah said: As the verse states, "But your blood, of your lives, will I require," even with only one judge. English translation: What are the consequences? Rav Yehudah said: As the verse states, "But your blood, of your lives, will I require," even with only one judge.

hebrew_text: ״מִיָּד כׇּל חַיָּה״, אֲפִילּוּ שֶׁלֹּא בְּהַתְרָאָה. ״אֶדְרְשֶׁנּוּ וּמִיַּד הָאָדָם״, אֲפִילּוּ בְּעֵד אֶחָד. ״מִיַּד אִישׁ״, וְלֹא מִיַּד אִשָּׁה. ״אָחִיו״, אֲפִילּוּ קָרוֹב.
human_translation: “at the hand of every animal” even without forewarning, “I will require it; and at the hand of man,” on the basis even one witness. “at the hand of every man,” but not at the hand of a woman. “his brother” even a relative
llm_translation: "Immediately all living," even without seeing. "I will seek him and immediately the man," even with one witness. "From the hand of a man," and not from the hand of a woman. "His brother," even if distant.

hebrew_text: מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל אָמְרוּ: אַף עַל הָעוּבָּרִין. מַאי טַעְמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל? דִּכְתִיב: ״שֹׁפֵךְ דַּם הָאָדָם בָּאָדָם דָּמוֹ יִשָּׁפֵךְ״. אֵיזֶהוּ אָדָם שֶׁהוּא בָּאָדָם? הֱוֵי אוֹמֵר: זֶה עוּבָּר שֶׁבִּמְעֵי אִמּוֹ.
human_translation: said in the name of Rabbi Yishmael: even for fetuses. What is the reason of Rabbi Yishmael? which is written: “One who sheds the blood of a person, by a person [ ba’adam ] his blood shall be shed” What is a person that is in a person? You must say: This is a fetus that is in its mother’s womb.
llm_translation: From the statement of Rabbi Yishmael they said: Even regarding fetuses. What is the reason of Rabbi Yishmael? As it is written: "Whoever sheds the blood of man, by man shall his blood be shed." Who is the man within man? One would say: This is a fetus in his mother's womb.

hebrew_text: וְתַנָּא קַמָּא תַּנָּא דְבֵי מְנַשֶּׁה הוּא, דְּאָמַר: כׇּל מִיתָה הָאֲמוּרָה לִבְנֵי נֹחַ אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא חֶנֶק, וּשְׁדִי לֵיהּ הַאי ״בָּאָדָם״ אַסֵּיפֵיהּ דִּקְרָא, וּדְרוֹשׁ בֵּיהּ הָכִי: ״בָּאָדָם דָּמוֹ יִשָּׁפֵךְ״ – אֵיזֶהוּ שְׁפִיכוּת דָּמִים שֶׁל אָדָם שֶׁהוּא בְּגוּפוֹ שֶׁל אָדָם? הֱוֵי אוֹמֵר: זֶה חֶנֶק.
human_translation: And the first tanna , is the tanna of the school of Menashe, who says all death stated with regard to the descendants of Noah are nothing other than strangulation. And Cast, this “In a person,” with regard to the latter of the verse, and interpret it homiletically like this: “In a person, his blood shall be shed.” what is a person’s blood shed while it is in person’s body, You must say this is strangulation.
llm_translation: And it was taught in the first Tanna of the House of Menashe, as he said: Every death mentioned for the sons of Noah is nothing but strangulation, and bring forth this verse "in man" and expound it thus: "In man, his blood shall be shed" - what is the shedding of blood of a man that is in the body of a man? One should say: this is strangulation.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַב הַמְנוּנָא: וְאִשָּׁה לָא מִפַּקְדָה? וְהָכְתִיב: ״כִּי יְדַעְתִּיו לְמַעַן אֲשֶׁר יְצַוֶּה וְגוֹ׳״!
human_translation: Rav Hamnuna raises an objection And is a woman not commanded But isn’t it written “For I have known him, to the end that he may command
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: But is a woman not obligated to perform the commandments? And it is written: "For I have known him, to the end that he may command his children and his household after him, and they may keep the way of the Lord" (Genesis 18:19)!

hebrew_text: הוּא מוֹתֵיב לַהּ וְהוּא מְפָרֵק לַהּ: ״בָּנָיו״ – לְדִין, ״בֵּיתוֹ״ – לִצְדָקָה.
human_translation: He raises the objection and he resolves it: his sons to justice, his household, to charity;
llm_translation: He sets for her and he explains to her: "His sons" - for judgment, "his house" - for charity.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַוְיָא סָבָא לְרַב פָּפָּא: אֵימָא בַּת נֹחַ שֶׁהָרְגָה לֹא תֵּיהָרֵג, ״מִיַּד אִישׁ״, וְלֹא ״מִיַּד אִשָּׁה״ כְּתִיב? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָכִי אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: ״שֹׁפֵךְ דַּם הָאָדָם״ – מִכׇּל מָקוֹם.
human_translation: Rav Avya the Elder said to Rav Pappa: say a female descendant of Noah who killed should not be executed; it is written: “At the hand of every man,” and not “at the hand of every woman”? said to him: This Rav Yehuda says: “one who sheds the blood of a person” in any case,
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Avya the Elder said to Rav Pappa: Say, the daughter of Noah who killed shall not be killed, "by the hand of a man" is written, and not "by the hand of a woman"? He said to him: Thus said Rav Yehudah: "Whoever sheds the blood of man" - from any place.

hebrew_text: אֵימָא: בַּת נֹחַ שֶׁזִּינְּתָה לֹא תֵּיהָרֵג, דִּכְתִיב ״עַל כֵּן יַעֲזׇב אִישׁ״ וְלֹא אִשָּׁה? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָכִי אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: ״וְהָיוּ לְבָשָׂר אֶחָד״ – הֲדַר עָרְבִינְהוּ קְרָא.
human_translation: say a female descendant of Noah who committed adultery should not be executed, as it is written: “Therefore a man shall leave but not a woman? said to him: This Rav Yehuda says: “And they shall be one flesh.” The verse then combines
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Eima: Bat Noach shezinnetah lo teihareg, dikhtiv 'al ken yaazov ish ve'lo isha?' Amar lei: hachi amar Rav Yehudah: 'vehayu levasar echad' - hadar arvinhu kera." English translation: "Say: The daughter of Noah who committed adultery shall not be put to death, as it is written, 'Therefore shall a man leave his father and his mother, and shall cleave unto his wife, and they shall be one flesh.' The verse has thus intermingled them."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״אִישׁ״, מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״אִישׁ אִישׁ״? לְרַבּוֹת אֶת הַגּוֹיִים, שֶׁמּוּזְהָרִין עַל הָעֲרָיוֹת כְּיִשְׂרָאֵל.
human_translation: The Sages taught One [ ish ] Why the verse state “no one”? to include the gentiles, who are prohibited from forbidden sexual relations, as Jews
llm_translation: The sages taught: "Man," what is the Talmud to say "man man"? To include the Gentiles, who are warned against forbidden relationships like Israel.

hebrew_text: וְהָא מֵהָכָא נָפְקָא? מֵהָתָם נָפְקָא! ״לֵאמֹר״ – זֶה גִּילּוּי עֲרָיוֹת.
human_translation: But is it derived from here? It is derived from there, saying” this forbidden sexual relations
llm_translation: And this, from here it comes out? It comes out from there! "To say" - this is the revelation of forbidden relationships.

hebrew_text: הָתָם בַּעֲרָיוֹת דִּידְהוּ, וְהָכָא בַּעֲרָיוֹת דִּידַן, דְּקָתָנֵי סֵיפָא: בָּא עַל עֲרָיוֹת יִשְׂרָאֵל – נִידּוֹן בְּדִינֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל.
human_translation: There, to their with whom relations are forbidden. And here to our with whom relations are forbidden. As it is taught in the latter clause engages in intercourse with those Jewish with whom relations are forbidden, he is judged according to the halakhot of the Jews.
llm_translation: There, in the case of our laws of forbidden relationships, and here, in the case of our laws of forbidden relationships, as it is taught in the latter clause: One who transgresses the forbidden relationships of Israel - is judged by the laws of Israel.

hebrew_text: לְמַאי הִלְכְתָא? אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ: לֹא נִצְרְכָה אֶלָּא לָעֵדָה, וְעֵדִים, וְהַתְרָאָה.
human_translation: With regard to what halakha Rav Naḥman says Rabba bar Avuh says: is necessary only by a Sanhedrin, and witnesses and a forewarning
llm_translation: Regarding what halakha? Rav Nahman said, Rabba bar Avuh said: It was only necessary for testimony, witnesses, and warning.

hebrew_text: מִגְרָע גָּרַע?
human_translation: less
llm_translation: He diminished, did he diminish?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב יוֹחָנָן: לֹא נִצְרְכָה אֶלָּא לְנַעֲרָה הַמְאוֹרָסָה, דִּלְדִידְהוּ לֵית לְהוּ, דְּדָיְינִינַן לְהוּ בְּדִינָא דִּידַן.
human_translation: Rather, Rabbi Yoḥanan says: is necessary only to a betrothed young woman, which not to we judge them according to our halakha
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Yochanan said: It was only necessary for the betrothed maiden, for according to them, they do not have the ability to judge her as we do in our judgment.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל אֵשֶׁת אִישׁ, בְּדִינָא דִּידְהוּ דָּיְינִינַן לְהוּ? וְהָתַנְיָא: בָּא עַל נַעֲרָה הַמְאוֹרָסָה – נִידּוֹן בִּסְקִילָה, עַל אֵשֶׁת אִישׁ – נִידּוֹן בְּחֶנֶק. וְאִי בְּדִינָא דִּידְהוּ, סַיִיף הוּא!
human_translation: And a married woman, do we judge them according to their halakha ? But isn’t it taught engages in intercourse with a betrothed young woman, he is punished by stoning; with a married woman he is punished by strangulation? And if according to their halakha , be sword.
llm_translation: But a married woman, in their judgment, do we judge for them? And it was taught: If one has relations with a betrothed maiden - he is judged by stoning, if with a married woman - he is judged by strangulation. And if in their judgment, it is a sword!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: מַאי אֵשֶׁת אִישׁ דְּקָתָנֵי? כְּגוֹן שֶׁנִּכְנְסָה לְחוּפָּה וְלֹא נִבְעֲלָה, דִּלְדִידְהוּ לֵית לְהוּ. דָּיְינִינַן לְהוּ בְּדִינָא דִּידַן.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak says: What A married woman, which teaches? where had entered the wedding canopy but had not engaged in intercourse Since with regard to not we judge them according to our halakhot .
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: What is the meaning of "a married woman" as it is taught? For example, if she entered the wedding canopy but did not consummate the marriage, according to us, she is not considered married. We can judge them according to our law.

hebrew_text: דְּתָנֵי רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: בְּעוּלַת בַּעַל – יֵשׁ לָהֶן, נִכְנְסָה לְחוּפָּה וְלֹא נִבְעֲלָה – אֵין לָהֶן.
human_translation: As Rabbi Ḥanina teaches: have who has engaged in intercourse with her husband, they cannot have who has entered the wedding canopy but has not engaged in intercourse
llm_translation: It was taught by Rabbi Chanina: Regarding the wife of a Baal - if she entered the wedding canopy and did not consummate the marriage, she has the status of a wife.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּוָותֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כׇּל עֶרְוָה שֶׁבֵּית דִּין שֶׁל יִשְׂרָאֵל מְמִיתִין עָלֶיהָ – בֶּן נֹחַ מוּזְהָר עָלֶיהָ. אֵין בֵּית דִּין שֶׁל יִשְׂרָאֵל מְמִיתִין עָלֶיהָ – אֵין בֶּן נֹחַ מוּזְהָר עָלֶיהָ. דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: הַרְבֵּה עֲרָיוֹת יֵשׁ שֶׁאֵין בֵּית דִּין שֶׁל יִשְׂרָאֵל מְמִיתִין עֲלֵיהֶן, וּבֶן נֹחַ מוּזְהָר עֲלֵיהֶן.
human_translation: It is taught in accordance with of Rabbi Yoḥanan: Any forbidden sexual relations for which a Jewish court administers capital punishment are prohibited to a descendant of Noah, for which a Jewish court does not administer capital punishment are not prohibited to a descendant of Noah; the statement of Rabbi Meir. And the Rabbis say: There are many forbidden sexual relations for which a Jewish court does not administer capital punishment and are prohibited to a descendant of Noah.
llm_translation: It was taught in accordance with the opinion of Rabbi Yochanan: Any nakedness that is punishable by death in the court of Israel, a Noahide is warned about it. If the court of Israel does not punish with death for it, a Noahide is not warned about it. These are the words of Rabbi Meir. And the Sages say: There are many forbidden relationships for which the court of Israel does not punish with death, but a Noahide is warned about them.

hebrew_text: בָּא עַל עֲרָיוֹת יִשְׂרָאֵל – נִידּוֹן בְּדִינֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל. בָּא עַל עֲרָיוֹת בֶּן נֹחַ – נִידּוֹן בְּדִינֵי בֶּן נֹחַ. וְאָנוּ אֵין לָנוּ אֶלָּא נַעֲרָה הַמְאוֹרָסָה בִּלְבַד.
human_translation: engages in intercourse with those Jews with whom relations are forbidden, he is judged according to the halakhot of the Jews. engages in intercourse with those descendants of Noah with whom relations are forbidden, he is judged according to the halakhot of the descendants of Noah. And we have only a betrothed young woman
llm_translation: He came upon the forbidden relationships of Israel - he is judged by the laws of Israel. He came upon the forbidden relationships of a Noahide - he is judged by the laws of a Noahide. And we have nothing except for a betrothed maiden alone.

hebrew_text: וְנִחְשׁוֹב נָמֵי נִכְנְסָה לְחוּפָּה וְלֹא נִבְעֲלָה? הַאי תַּנָּא תַּנָּא דְבֵי מְנַשֶּׁה הוּא, דְּאָמַר: כׇּל מִיתָה הָאֲמוּרָה לִבְנֵי נֹחַ אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא חֶנֶק. אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי חֶנֶק הוּא.
human_translation: And let also count had entered the wedding canopy but had not engaged in intercourse This tanna is the tanna of the school of Menashe, who says all death stated with regard to the descendants of Noah are nothing other than strangulation, this and that strangulation;
llm_translation: "And it was thought that she entered the wedding canopy and did not consummate? This Mishna is the Mishna of the house of Menashe, as it says: 'Every death mentioned for the descendants of Noah is nothing but strangulation.' Both this and that are strangulation."

hebrew_text: וְסָבַר רַבִּי מֵאִיר: כׇּל עֶרְוָה שֶׁבֵּית דִּין שֶׁל יִשְׂרָאֵל מְמִיתִין עָלֶיהָ, בֶּן נֹחַ מוּזְהָר עָלֶיהָ? וְהָא תַּנְיָא: גֵּר
human_translation: And does Rabbi Meir hold any forbidden sexual relations for which a Jewish court administers capital punishment are prohibited to a descendant of Noah? But isn’t it taught a convert
llm_translation: And Rabbi Meir holds: Any nakedness in the court of Israel, they put to death for it, a Noahide should be cautious about it? But it was taught: A convert...

hebrew_text: שֶׁהָיְתָה הוֹרָתוֹ שֶׁלֹּא בִּקְדוּשָּׁה, וְלֵידָתוֹ בִּקְדוּשָּׁה – יֵשׁ לוֹ שְׁאֵר הָאֵם, וְאֵין לוֹ שְׁאֵר הָאָב.
human_translation: who was not conceived in sanctity, but his birth was in sanctity, he has maternal kinship, but he does not have paternal kinship.
llm_translation: His conception was not in holiness, and his birth was in holiness - he has the status of the mother's lineage, and he does not have the status of the father's lineage.

hebrew_text: הָא כֵּיצַד? נָשָׂא אֲחוֹתוֹ מִן הָאֵם – יוֹצִיא, מִן הָאָב – יְקַיֵּים. אֲחוֹת הָאָב מִן הָאֵם – יוֹצִיא, מִן הָאָב – יְקַיֵּים.
human_translation: How so? he married his maternal half sister, he must divorce paternal he may maintain father’s maternal half sister, he must divorce her. paternal he may maintain
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "How so? If he marries his sister from the mother - he shall divorce her; from the father - he shall fulfill. His father's sister from the mother - he shall divorce her; from the father - he shall fulfill."

hebrew_text: אֲחוֹת הָאֵם מִן הָאֵם – יוֹצִיא. אֲחוֹת הָאֵם מִן הָאָב, רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: יוֹצִיא, וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: יְקַיֵּים. שֶׁהָיָה רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: כׇּל עֶרְוָה שֶׁהִיא מִשּׁוּם שְׁאֵר אֵם – יוֹצִיא, מִשּׁוּם שְׁאֵר הָאָב – יְקַיֵּים.
human_translation: mother’s maternal half sister, he must divorce mother’s paternal half sister, Rabbi Meir says he must divorce and the Rabbis say he may maintain As Rabbi Meir would say: any forbidden relative who is due to maternal kinship, he must divorce due to paternal kinship, he may maintain
llm_translation: The mother's sister from the mother - he shall take out. The mother's sister from the father, Rabbi Meir says: he shall take out, and the sages say: he shall uphold. For Rabbi Meir used to say: any nakedness that is due to the mother's flesh - he shall take out, due to the father's flesh - he shall uphold.

hebrew_text: וּמוּתָּר בְּאֵשֶׁת אָחִיו, וּבְאֵשֶׁת אֲחִי אָבִיו, וּשְׁאָר כׇּל עֲרָיוֹת מוּתָּרוֹת לוֹ. לְאֵתוֹיֵי אֵשֶׁת אָבִיו.
human_translation: And permitted to his brother’s wife and his father’s brother’s wife, and all other with whom relations are forbidden are permitted to him. to include his father’s wife,
llm_translation: And permitted in wife of his brother, and in wife of brother of his father, and other all forbidden relationships permitted to him. To exclude wife of his father.

hebrew_text: נָשָׂא אִשָּׁה וּבִתָּהּ, כּוֹנֵס אַחַת וּמוֹצִיא אַחַת. וּלְכַתְּחִילָּה לֹא יִכְנוֹס. מֵתָה אִשְׁתּוֹ, מוּתָּר בַּחֲמוֹתוֹ. וְאִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: אָסוּר בַּחֲמוֹתוֹ.
human_translation: married a woman and her daughter he may marry one but must divorce one; and he should not marry ab initio . his wife, died, permitted to his mother-in-law And some say prohibited from his mother-in-law.
llm_translation: He married a woman and her daughter, he may marry one and divorce one. And ideally, he should not marry at all. If his wife dies, he is permitted to marry her mother. And there are those who say: He is forbidden to marry her mother.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: לָא קַשְׁיָא, הָא רַבִּי מֵאִיר אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, וְהָא רַבִּי מֵאִיר אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says: not difficult; this Rabbi Meir according to of Rabbi Eliezer, and that Rabbi Meir according to of Rabbi Akiva.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said: It is not difficult, for Rabbi Meir is in accordance with the opinion of Rabbi Eliezer, and Rabbi Meir is in accordance with the opinion of Rabbi Akiva.

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: ״עַל כֵּן יַעֲזׇב אִישׁ אֶת אָבִיו וְאֶת אִמּוֹ״. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: ״אָבִיו״ – אֲחוֹת אָבִיו, ״אִמּוֹ״ – אֲחוֹת אִמּוֹ. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: ״אָבִיו״ – אֵשֶׁת אָבִיו, ״אִמּוֹ״ – אִמּוֹ מַמָּשׁ.
human_translation: As it is taught “Therefore a man shall leave his father and his mother, Rabbi Eliezer says: “His father” his father’s sister, “His mother” his mother’s sister. Rabbi Akiva says: “His father” his father’s wife; “his mother” his mother, literally.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: "Therefore a man shall leave his father and his mother." Rabbi Eliezer says: "His father" - his father's sister, "his mother" - his mother's sister. Rabbi Akiva says: "His father" - his father's wife, "his mother" - his actual mother.

hebrew_text: ״וְדָבַק״ – וְלֹא בְּזָכָר. ״בְּאִשְׁתּוֹ״ – וְלֹא בְּאֵשֶׁת חֲבֵירוֹ. ״וְהָיוּ לְבָשָׂר אֶחָד״ – מִי שֶׁנַּעֲשִׂים בָּשָׂר אֶחָד, יָצְאוּ בְּהֵמָה וְחַיָּה שֶׁאֵין נַעֲשִׂין בָּשָׂר אֶחָד.
human_translation: “And shall cleave but not to a male; “To his wife,” but not to the wife of another “And they shall be one flesh” those whom become one flesh, excludes domesticated and undomesticated animals, as they do not become one flesh.
llm_translation: "and cling" - not with a male. "with his wife" - and not with the wife of his friend. "and they shall become one flesh" - one who is made of one flesh, they have exited with an animal and a wild beast that are not made of one flesh.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר ״אָבִיו״ – אֲחוֹת אָבִיו. אֵימָא: אָבִיו מַמָּשׁ? הַיְינוּ ״וְדָבַק״, וְלֹא בְּזָכָר.
human_translation: The Master said Rabbi Eliezer says: “His father” his father’s sister. say his father, literally, This is “And shall cleave but not to a male;
llm_translation: The Master said: Rabbi Eliezer says, "His father" - his father's sister. Perhaps: his actual father? That is "and cleave," and not with a male.

hebrew_text: אֵימָא: אֵשֶׁת אָבִיו? הַיְינוּ ״בְּאִשְׁתּוֹ״ וְלֹא בְּאֵשֶׁת חֲבֵירוֹ. אֵימָא: לְאַחַר מִיתָה? דּוּמְיָא דְּאִמּוֹ: מָה אִמּוֹ דְּלָאו אִישׁוּת, אַף אָבִיו דְּלָאו אִישׁוּת.
human_translation: say his father’s wife? This is “to his wife,” but not to the wife of another say after death, similar to “his mother.” Just as his mother is not marriage so too, “his father” not marriage.
llm_translation: Mother: his father's wife? That is "with his wife" and not with his fellow's wife. Mother: after death? Similar to his mother: just as his mother is not his wife, so too his father is not his wife.

hebrew_text: ״אִמּוֹ״ – אֲחוֹת אִמּוֹ. וְאֵימָא אִמּוֹ מַמָּשׁ? הַיְינוּ בְּאִשְׁתּוֹ וְלֹא בְּאֵשֶׁת חֲבֵירוֹ. וְאֵימָא לְאַחַר מִיתָה? דּוּמְיָא דְּאָבִיו: מָה אָבִיו דְּלָאו מַמָּשׁ, אַף אִמּוֹ דְּלָאו מַמָּשׁ.
human_translation: “his mother” his mother’s sister. But say his mother, literally? This is “to his wife,” but not to the wife of another But say after death, similar to “his father.” Just as “his father” is not literally, so too, “his mother” is not literally.
llm_translation: "Imo" - his mother's sister. And why not his actual mother? That is in reference to his wife and not his friend's wife. And why not after her death? Similar to his father: just as his father who is not actual, so too his mother who is not actual.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: ״אָבִיו״ – אֵשֶׁת אָבִיו. וְאֵימָא: אָבִיו מַמָּשׁ? הַיְינוּ ״וְדָבַק״ – וְלֹא בְּזָכָר. אִי הָכִי, אֵשֶׁת אָבִיו נָמֵי הַיְינוּ ״בְּאִשְׁתּוֹ״ וְלֹא בְּאֵשֶׁת חֲבֵרוֹ! לְאַחַר מִיתָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: “His father” his father’s wife. But say his father, literally? That is “and shall cleave but not to a male. If so, his father’s wife is also “To his wife,” but not to the wife of another after death,
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: "His father" - his father's wife. And why? His actual father? That is "and cleave" - and not with a male. If so, his father's wife also means "with his wife" and not with his friend's wife! After his death.

hebrew_text: ״אִמּוֹ״ – אִמּוֹ מַמָּשׁ. הַיְינוּ ״בְּאִשְׁתּוֹ״ וְלֹא בְּאֵשֶׁת חֲבֵרוֹ! אִמּוֹ מֵאֲנוּסָתוֹ.
human_translation: “His mother” his mother, literally. That is “to his wife,” but not to the wife of another his mother whom raped,
llm_translation: "Imo" - his actual mother. That is, "with his wife" and not with his friend's wife! His mother is his forced one.

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי קָא מִיפַּלְגִי? רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר סָבַר:
human_translation: With regard to what do disagree? Rabbi Eliezer holds
llm_translation: With what do they argue? Rabbi Eliezer holds:

hebrew_text: אָבִיו דּוּמְיָא דְּאִמּוֹ, וְאִמּוֹ דּוּמְיָא דְּאָבִיו. לָא מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ אֶלָּא בְּאַחְוָוה.
human_translation: “his father” similar to “his mother,” and “his mother” similar to “his father.” You find only with regard to sisterhood,
llm_translation: His father is similar to his mother, and his mother is similar to his father. He only recognizes her through siblinghood.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: מוּטָב לְאוֹקְמֵיהּ בְּאֵשֶׁת אָבִיו, דְּאִיקְּרַי ״עֶרְוַת אָבִיו״, לְאַפּוֹקֵי אֲחוֹת אָבִיו, דִּ״שְׁאֵר אָבִיו״ אִיקְּרַי, ״עֶרְוַת אָבִיו״ לָא אִיקְּרַי.
human_translation: And Rabbi Akiva it is preferable to interpret to his father’s wife, who is referred to as his father’s nakedness to the exclusion of his father’s sister, who is referred to as his father’s kin is not referred to as his father’s nakedness.
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: It is better to establish him with the wife of his father, as it is called "the nakedness of his father," than to go out with the sister of his father, which is called "the flesh of his father," "the nakedness of his father" is not called.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: ״וַיִּקַּח עַמְרָם אֶת יוֹכֶבֶד דֹּדָתוֹ״. מַאי לָאו, דּוֹדָתוֹ מִן הָאֵם?
human_translation: Come hear “And Amram took Jochebed his aunt What, not his maternal aunt?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Ta shma: 'vayikach amram et yokheved dodato'. mai lavo, dodato min haem?" English translation: Come and hear: "And Amram took Yokheved his father's sister." What is the reason that she is called his father's sister and not his mother?

hebrew_text: לֹא, דּוֹדָתוֹ מִן הָאָב.
human_translation: No, his paternal aunt,
llm_translation: Not, his aunt from the father.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: ״וְגַם אׇמְנָה אֲחֹתִי בַת אָבִי הִיא אַךְ לֹא בַת אִמִּי״ – מִכְּלָל דְּבַת הָאֵם אֲסוּרָה.
human_translation: Come hear “And moreover, she is my sister, the daughter of my father, but not the daughter of my mother; By inference, the daughter of the mother is forbidden
llm_translation: "Come and hear: 'And also she is my sister, the daughter of my father, but not the daughter of my mother' - from the inference that the daughter of the mother is forbidden."

hebrew_text: וְתִסְבְּרָא אֲחוֹתוֹ הֲוַאי? בַּת אָחִיו הֲוַאי! וְכֵיוָן דְּהָכִי הוּא, לָא שְׁנָא מִן הָאָב וְלָא שְׁנָא מִן הָאֵם – שַׁרְיָא. אֶלָּא הָתָם הָכִי קָאָמַר לֵיהּ: קוּרְבָּא דְּאָחוֹת אִית לִי בַּהֲדַהּ, מֵאַבָּא וְלָא מֵאִמָּא.
human_translation: But you understand was sister? She was his brother’s daughter. And since that was so, is no difference paternal and is no difference maternal permitted Rather, this was saying to there: She is related to me like a sister, from father but not from mother.
llm_translation: And his sister, was she his sister? She was the daughter of his brother! And since this is the case, it is no different from the father or from the mother - it is permitted. Rather, there he was saying to him: The closeness of a sister I have in her, from the father but not from the mother.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: מִפְּנֵי מָה לֹא נָשָׂא אָדָם אֶת בִּתּוֹ? כְּדֵי שֶׁיִּשָּׂא קַיִן אֶת אֲחוֹתוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי אָמַרְתִּי עוֹלָם חֶסֶד יִבָּנֶה״. הָא לָאו הָכִי – אֲסִירָא.
human_translation: Come hear For what did Adam not marry his daughter? So that Cain would marry his sister as it is stated: “For I have said: The world shall be built on kindness [ ḥesed ]” not so, forbidden
llm_translation: Come and hear: For what reason did a man not marry off his daughter? In order for Cain to marry his sister, as it is stated: "For I have said, 'Forever kindness will be built.'" Is it not so? - A question.

hebrew_text: כֵּיוָן דְּאִשְׁתְּרַי, אִשְׁתְּרַי.
human_translation: Once it was permitted it was permitted
llm_translation: As it is established, it is established.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: גּוֹי מוּתָּר בְּבִתּוֹ. וְאֵם תֹּאמַר: מִפְּנֵי מָה לֹא נָשָׂא אָדָם אֶת בִּתּוֹ? כְּדֵי שֶׁיִּשָּׂא קַיִן אֶת אֲחוֹתוֹ, מִשּׁוּם ״עוֹלָם חֶסֶד יִבָּנֶה״.
human_translation: Rav Huna says: A gentile is permitted to his daughter. And if you say, for what did Adam not marry his daughter? so that Cain would marry his sister, because “The world shall be built on kindness.”
llm_translation: Rav Huna said: A non-Jew is permitted with his daughter. And if you will say: Why did not a man marry his daughter? In order that Cain may marry his sister, because of "the world is built on kindness."

hebrew_text: וְאִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא, גּוֹי אָסוּר בְּבִתּוֹ. תִּדַּע, שֶׁלֹּא נָשָׂא אָדָם אֶת בִּתּוֹ. וְלָא הִיא, הָתָם הַיְינוּ טַעְמָא: כְּדֵי שֶׁיִּשָּׂא קַיִן אֶת אֲחוֹתוֹ, מִשּׁוּם דְּ״עוֹלָם חֶסֶד יִבָּנֶה״.
human_translation: And there are who say Rav Huna says: A gentile is prohibited from his daughter. Know as Adam did not marry his daughter. But is not so, as there, this is the reason So that Cain would marry his sister, because “The world shall be built on kindness.”
llm_translation: There are those who say: Rav Huna said, a non-Jew is forbidden in his daughter. Know that no man married his daughter. And it is not so, there the reason is: in order that Cain may marry his sister, because "forever kindness shall be built."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: עֶבֶד מוּתָּר בְּאִמּוֹ, וּמוּתָּר בְּבִתּוֹ. יָצָא מִכְּלַל גּוֹי, וְלִכְלַל יִשְׂרָאֵל לֹא בָּא.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda says: slave permitted to his mother, and permitted to his daughter. left the category of a gentile but he has not entered the category of a Jew,
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: A slave is permitted with his mother, and permitted with his daughter. If he left the category of a gentile, he does not enter the category of an Israelite.

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא רַב דִּימִי, אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: בֶּן נֹחַ שֶׁיִּיחֵד שִׁפְחָה לְעַבְדּוֹ, וּבָא עָלֶיהָ – נֶהֱרָג עָלֶיהָ.
human_translation: When Rav Dimi came Rabbi Elazar says Rabbi Ḥanina says: descendant of Noah who designated a maidservant for his slave, and engaged in intercourse with her, he is executed on her account.
llm_translation: When Rav Dimi came, Rabbi Elazar said in the name of Rabbi Chanina: A Noachide who cohabits with his maidservant and has relations with her - he is liable to be executed.

hebrew_text: מֵאֵימַת? אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: מִדְּקָרְאוּ לַהּ ״רְבִיתָא דִּפְלָנְיָא״. מֵאֵימַת הַתָּרָתָהּ? אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: מִשֶּׁפָּרְעָה רֹאשָׁהּ בַּשּׁוּק.
human_translation: From when Rav Naḥman says: From that she is called so-and-so’s girl. From when is she released Rav Huna says: From that she exposes her head in the marketplace.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: From when? Rav Nachman said: From when they called her "the wife of Ploni." From when was she permitted? Rav Huna said: From when she let down her hair in the marketplace.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: בֶּן נֹחַ שֶׁבָּא עַל אִשְׁתּוֹ שֶׁלֹּא כְּדַרְכָּהּ – חַיָּיב, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְדָבַק״, וְלֹא שֶׁלֹּא כְּדַרְכָּהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar says Rabbi Ḥanina says: A descendant of Noah who engages in intercourse with his wife in an atypical manner, is liable as it is stated: “And shall cleave but not in an atypical manner.
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said, Rabbi Chanina said: A Noahide who has relations with his wife not in the customary manner - is liable, as it is stated: "And cleave," and not that it is not in the customary manner.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: מִי אִיכָּא מִידֵּי דְּיִשְׂרָאֵל לָא מִחַיַּיב, וְנׇכְרִי מִחַיַּיב?
human_translation: Rava says: Is there any for which a Jew is not deemed liable, but a gentile is deemed liable
llm_translation: Rava said: From the hands of a Jew, one is not obligated, but from the hands of a non-Jew, one is obligated.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: בֶּן נֹחַ שֶׁבָּא עַל אֵשֶׁת חֲבֵירוֹ שֶׁלֹּא כְּדַרְכָּהּ – פָּטוּר. מַאי טַעְמָא? ״בְּאִשְׁתּוֹ״ – וְלֹא בְּאֵשֶׁת חֲבֵירוֹ; ״וְדָבַק״ – וְלָא שֶׁלֹּא כְּדַרְכָּהּ.
human_translation: Rather, Rava says descendant of Noah who engages in intercourse with the wife of another in an atypical manner is exempt. What is the reason? to his wife,” but not to the wife of another. “And shall cleave,” and not in an atypical manner.
llm_translation: Rava said: A Ben Noach who comes upon the wife of his fellow in a manner not typical of her - he is exempt. What is the reason? "With his wife" - and not with the wife of his fellow; "and he clings" - and not in a manner not typical of her.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: גּוֹי שֶׁהִכָּה אֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל חַיָּיב מִיתָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיִּפֶן כֹּה וָכֹה וַיַּרְא כִּי אֵין אִישׁ [וַיַּךְ אֶת הַמִּצְרִי] וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina says: A gentile who struck a Jew is liable death as it is stated “And he turned this way and that way, and when he saw that there was no man, he struck the Egyptian
llm_translation: Rabbi Chanina said: A gentile who strikes a Jew is liable to the death penalty, as it is stated: "And he turned this way and that way, and he saw that there was no man so he struck the Egyptian" (Exodus 2:12).

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: הַסּוֹטֵר לוֹעוֹ שֶׁל יִשְׂרָאֵל כְּאִילּוּ סוֹטֵר לוֹעוֹ שֶׁל שְׁכִינָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״מוֹקֵשׁ אָדָם יָלַע קֹדֶשׁ״.
human_translation: And Rabbi Ḥanina says: One who slaps the cheek of a Jew as though he slapped the cheek of the Divine Presence; as it is stated: “It is a snare [ mokesh ] for a man to rashly say [ yala ]: Holy”
llm_translation: And Rabbi Chanina said: One who insults a Jew, it is as though he insults the Divine Presence, as it is stated: "A man who blasphemes the Holy One."

hebrew_text: מַגְבִּיהַּ, עַבְדּוֹ, שָׁבַת – סִימָן. אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: הַמַּגְבִּיהַּ יָדוֹ עַל חֲבֵירוֹ, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁלֹּא הִכָּהוּ, נִקְרָא רָשָׁע, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיֹּאמֶר לָרָשָׁע לָמָּה תַכֶּה רֵעֶךָ״. ״לָמָּה הִכִּיתָ״ לֹא נֶאֱמַר, אֶלָּא ״לָמָּה תַכֶּה״ – אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁלֹּא הִכָּהוּ נִקְרָא רָשָׁע.
human_translation: a mnemonic Raises, his slave, Shabbat. Reish Lakish says: One who raises his hand to another, even if he does not strike him, is called wicked, as it is stated: and he said to the wicked one: Why should you strike your friend?” Why did you strike, is not stated, rather: “Why should you strike,” even if he did not strike him, is called wicked.
llm_translation: He who raises his hand against his fellow, even though he did not strike him, is called wicked, as it is said: "And he said to the wicked one, 'Why do you strike your fellow?'" It does not say, "Why did you strike," but rather "Why do you strike" - even though he did not strike him, he is called wicked.

hebrew_text: אָמַר זְעֵירִי אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: נִקְרָא חוֹטֵא, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְאִם לֹא לָקַחְתִּי בְחׇזְקָה״, וּכְתִיב: ״וַתְּהִי חַטַּאת הַנְּעָרִים גְּדוֹלָה מְאֹד״.
human_translation: Ze’eiri says Rabbi Ḥanina says: is called a sinner; as it is stated: and if not, I will take by force” and it is written “And the sin of the youths was very great”
llm_translation: Zei'ri said, Rabbi Chanina said: It is called a sin, as it is stated: "And if you did not take her by force," and it is written: "And the sin of the young men was very great."

hebrew_text: רַב הוּנָא אָמַר: תִּיקָּצֵץ יָדוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּזְרוֹעַ רָמָה תִּשָּׁבֵר״. רַב הוּנָא קַץ יְדָא.
human_translation: Rav Huna says: His hand should be cut off, as it is stated: “And the high arm shall be broken” Rav Huna cut off the hand
llm_translation: Rav Huna said: "His hand will be cut off," as it is stated: "And the high arm will be broken." Rav Huna cut off his hand.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: אֵין לוֹ תַּקָּנָה אֶלָּא קְבוּרָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְאִישׁ זְרוֹעַ לוֹ הָאָרֶץ״.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar says: has no remedy but burial, as it is stated: “And as a mighty man [ ve’ish zero’a ], who has the earth”
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar says: He has no remedy except burial, as it is stated: "And a man has his arm for himself the land."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: לֹא נִתְּנָה קַרְקַע אֶלָּא לְבַעֲלֵי זְרוֹעוֹת, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְאִישׁ זְרוֹעַ לוֹ הָאָרֶץ״.
human_translation: And Rabbi Elazar states The land is given only to mighty men as it is stated: “And as a mighty man, who has the earth.”
llm_translation: And Rabbi Elazar said: The ground was given only to those with arms, as it is said: "And the earth has been given to him with arms."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: מַאי דִּכְתִיב ״עֹבֵד אַדְמָתוֹ יִשְׂבַּע לָחֶם״? אִם עוֹשֶׂה אָדָם עַצְמוֹ כְּעֶבֶד לָאֲדָמָה – יִשְׂבַּע לֶחֶם, וְאִם לָאו – לֹא יִשְׂבַּע לֶחֶם.
human_translation: And Reish Lakish says: What which is written: “One who works [ oved ] his land shall have plenty of bread” If a person makes himself like a slave [ ke’eved ] to the land, he will have plenty of bread, but if not, he will not have plenty of bread.
llm_translation: And Reish Lakish said: What is the meaning of the verse, "He who works his land will have his fill of bread"? If a person makes himself like a servant to the land - he will have his fill of bread, but if not - he will not have his fill of bread.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: נׇכְרִי שֶׁשָּׁבַת חַיָּיב מִיתָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְיוֹם וָלַיְלָה לֹא יִשְׁבֹּתוּ״. וְאָמַר מָר: אַזְהָרָה שֶׁלָּהֶן זוֹ הִיא מִיתָתָן. אָמַר רָבִינָא: אֲפִילּוּ שֵׁנִי בַּשַּׁבָּת.
human_translation: And Reish Lakish says: A gentile who observed Shabbat is liable death as it is stated: “And day and night shall not cease” And the Master said their prohibition is their death Ravina says: even on a Monday,
llm_translation: And Reish Lakish said: A gentile who observed Shabbat is liable to the death penalty, as it is stated: "And day and night they shall not rest." And Mar said: Their warning is their death. Ravina said: Even if he observed a second time on Shabbat.

hebrew_text: וְלִיחְשְׁבַהּ גַּבֵּי שֶׁבַע מִצְוֹת? כִּי קָא חָשֵׁיב – שֵׁב וְאַל תַּעֲשֶׂה, קוּם עֲשֵׂה לָא קָא חָשֵׁיב.
human_translation: But let count among seven mitzvot. When counts sit and refrain from action, He does not count arise and take action.
llm_translation: And to reckon it regarding the seven commandments? When it is being reckoned - sitting and not doing is reckoned, standing and doing is not reckoned.

hebrew_text: וְהָא דִּינִין קוּם עֲשֵׂה הוּא, וְקָא חָשֵׁיב? קוּם עֲשֵׂה וְשֵׁב אַל תַּעֲשֶׂה נִינְהוּ.
human_translation: But judgment is stand up and take action, and he counts it stand up and take action, and sit and refrain from action,
llm_translation: And this that the laws of positive commandments are considered as if they are negative commandments? They are considered as if they are negative commandments, and do not do them.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: גּוֹי שֶׁעוֹסֵק בַּתּוֹרָה חַיָּיב מִיתָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״תּוֹרָה צִוָּה לָנוּ מֹשֶׁה מוֹרָשָׁה״, לָנוּ מוֹרָשָׁה וְלֹא לָהֶם.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan says: A gentile who engages in Torah liable death as it is stated: “Moses commanded us a law [ torah ], an inheritance it is an inheritance for us, and not for them.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yochanan said: A gentile who engages in Torah study is liable to death, as it is stated: "Moses commanded us the Torah as an inheritance," an inheritance for us and not for them.

hebrew_text: וְלִיחְשְׁבַהּ גַּבֵּי שֶׁבַע מִצְוֹת? מַאן דְּאָמַר ״מוֹרָשָׁה״ – מִיגְזָל קָא גָזֵיל לַהּ. מַאן דְּאָמַר ״מְאוֹרָסָה״ – דִּינוֹ כְּנַעֲרָה הַמְאוֹרָסָה, דְּבִסְקִילָה.
human_translation: But let count among seven mitzvot. the one who says an inheritance, robs it. the one who says betrothed, the punishment of is like a betrothed young woman, which is by stoning.
llm_translation: And to consider it regarding the seven commandments? Whoever said "inheritance" - he steals from her. Whoever said "betrothed" - his judgment is like that of a betrothed maiden, by stoning.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי, הָיָה רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: מִנַּיִין שֶׁאֲפִילּוּ גּוֹי וְעוֹסֵק בַּתּוֹרָה שֶׁהוּא כְּכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל? שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אֲשֶׁר יַעֲשֶׂה אֹתָם הָאָדָם וָחַי בָּהֶם״. ״כֹּהֲנִים לְוִיִּים וְיִשְׂרְאֵלִים״ לֹא נֶאֱמַר, אֶלָּא ״הָאָדָם״. הָא לָמַדְתָּ שֶׁאֲפִילּוּ גּוֹי וְעוֹסֵק בַּתּוֹרָה הֲרֵי הוּא כְּכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל.
human_translation: raises an objection Rabbi Meir would say: From where that even a gentile who engages in Torah is like a High Priest? that is stated: which if a man does he shall live by them” priests, Levites, and Israelites is not stated, rather: “A man,” You have therefore learned that even a gentile who engages in Torah is like a High Priest.
llm_translation: Challenger: Rabbi Meir used to say: From where do we derive that even a non-Jew who engages in Torah study is like a High Priest? As it is stated: "Which a man shall do and live by them." It does not say, "Kohanim, Levites, and Israelites," but rather, "a man." This teaches us that even a non-Jew who engages in Torah study is like a High Priest.

hebrew_text: הָתָם, בְּשֶׁבַע מִצְוֹת דִּידְהוּ.
human_translation: There, in their seven mitzvot.
llm_translation: There, in the seven commandments of theirs.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: אַף הַדָּם מִן הַחַי. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״אַךְ בָּשָׂר בְּנַפְשׁוֹ דָמוֹ לֹא תֹאכֵלוּ״ – זֶה אֵבֶר מִן הַחַי. רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: אַף הַדָּם מִן הַחַי.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina ben Gamliel says: also the blood from a living The Sages taught “Only flesh with its life, which is its blood, you shall not eat” this is a limb from a living Rabbi Ḥanina ben Gamliel says: The blood from a living also
llm_translation: Rabbi Chanina ben Gamliel says: Even the blood from the living. The Rabbis taught: "But flesh with its life, its blood, you shall not eat" - this is a limb from a living animal. Rabbi Chanina ben Gamliel says: Even the blood from the living.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל? קְרִי בֵּיהּ: ״בָּשָׂר בְּנַפְשׁוֹ לֹא תֹּאכֵל״, ״דָּמוֹ בְּנַפְשׁוֹ לֹא תֹּאכֵל״. וְרַבָּנַן? הַהוּא לְמִישְׁרֵי שְׁרָצִים הוּא דַּאֲתָא.
human_translation: What is the reasoning of Rabbi Ḥanina ben Gamliel? reads into Flesh with its life you shall not eat; blood with its life you shall not eat. And the Rabbis That comes to permit creeping animals.
llm_translation: What is the reason for Rabbi Chanina ben Gamliel? It is written in it: "You shall not eat flesh with its life, that is, its blood." And the Rabbis? That is for the straightness of the creeping things that it came.

hebrew_text: כְּיוֹצֵא בַּדָּבָר אַתָּה אוֹמֵר: ״רַק חֲזַק לְבִלְתִּי אֲכֹל הַדָּם כִּי הַדָּם הוּא הַנָּפֶשׁ וְגוֹ׳״. ״רַק חֲזַק לְבִלְתִּי אֲכֹל הַדָּם״ – זֶה אֵבֶר מִן הַחַי, ״כִּי הַדָּם הוּא הַנָּפֶשׁ״ – זֶה דָּם מִן הַחַי.
human_translation: Similarly, you say “Only be steadfast in not eating blood, as the blood is the life, “Only be steadfast in not eating blood,” this is a limb from a living “as the blood is the life,” this is blood from a living
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "As an example in this matter, you say: 'Only be strong not to eat the blood, for the blood is the soul, etc.'" "'Only be strong not to eat the blood' – this is a limb from a living animal, 'for the blood is the soul' – this is blood from a living animal."

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן, הַהוּא לְדַם הַקָּזָה שֶׁהַנְּשָׁמָה יוֹצְאָה בּוֹ הוּא דַּאֲתָא.
human_translation: And the Rabbis, That comes to blood of bloodletting, through which the soul departs
llm_translation: The sages, that one for the blood of the bird that the soul departs in it, he is the one who came.

hebrew_text: לְמָה לִי לְמִיכְתַּב לִבְנֵי נֹחַ, וּלְמָה לִי לְמִשְׁנֵי בְּסִינַי?
human_translation: why do I to descendants of Noah, and why do I repeat at Sinai
llm_translation: Why do I need to write for the sons of Noah, and why do I need to repeat at Sinai?

hebrew_text: כִּדְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: כׇּל מִצְוָה שֶׁנֶּאֶמְרָה לִבְנֵי נֹחַ וְנִשְׁנֵית בְּסִינַי – לָזֶה וְלָזֶה נֶאֶמְרָה.
human_translation: in accordance with of Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina; as Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, says: Any mitzva that was stated with regard to the descendants of Noah and was repeated at Sinai was stated for this and for that
llm_translation: As Rabbi Yosei son of Rabbi Chanina said, for Rabbi Yosei son of Rabbi Chanina said: Any commandment that was stated for the descendants of Noah and repeated at Sinai - for this one and for that one it was stated.

hebrew_text: לִבְנֵי נֹחַ, וְלֹא נִשְׁנֵית בְּסִינַי – לְיִשְׂרָאֵל נֶאֶמְרָה וְלֹא לִבְנֵי נֹחַ. וְאָנוּ אֵין לָנוּ אֶלָּא גִּיד הַנָּשֶׁה, וְאַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: with regard to the descendants of Noah and was not repeated at Sinai was stated for the Jewish people and not for the descendants of Noah. And we have only the sciatic nerve and according to of Rabbi Yehuda,
llm_translation: To the sons of Noah, and not repeated at Sinai - it was said for Israel and not for the sons of Noah. And we have nothing except for the sinew of the thigh, in accordance with the opinion of Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: כׇּל מִצְוָה שֶׁנֶּאֶמְרָה לִבְנֵי נֹחַ וְנִשְׁנֵית בְּסִינַי, לָזֶה וְלָזֶה נֶאֶמְרָה. אַדְּרַבָּה, מִדְּנִשְׁנֵית בְּסִינַי – לְיִשְׂרָאֵל נֶאֶמְרָה וְלֹא לִבְנֵי נֹחַ!
human_translation: The Master said Any mitzva that was stated with regard to the descendants of Noah and was repeated at Sinai was stated for this and for that On the contrary, from that it was repeated at Sinai, it was stated for the Jewish people and not for the descendants of Noah,
llm_translation: Master said: Every commandment that was stated for the sons of Noah and repeated at Sinai, was stated for this one and for that one. On the contrary, from the fact that it was repeated at Sinai - it was stated for Israel and not for the sons of Noah!

hebrew_text: מִדְּאִיתְּנַי עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה בְּסִינַי, וְאַשְׁכְּחַן דַּעֲנַשׁ גּוֹיִם עִילָּוַוהּ, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: לָזֶה וְלָזֶה נֶאֶמְרָה.
human_translation: From that idol worship was repeated at Sinai, and we find that punished gentiles for it, conclude from it was stated for this and for that
llm_translation: From where is it taught that foreign worship was in Sinai, and we find that the nations were punished for it, hear from it: "To this one and to that one it was said."

hebrew_text: לִבְנֵי נֹחַ, וְלֹא נִשְׁנֵית בְּסִינַי – לְיִשְׂרָאֵל נֶאֶמְרָה וְלֹא לִבְנֵי נֹחַ. אַדְּרַבָּה, מִדְּלֹא נִישְׁנֵית בְּסִינַי – לִבְנֵי נֹחַ נֶאֶמְרָה וְלָא לְיִשְׂרָאֵל! לֵיכָּא מִידַּעַם דִּלְיִשְׂרָאֵל שְׁרֵי וּלְגוֹי אֲסִיר.
human_translation: with regard to the descendants of Noah and was not repeated at Sinai was stated for the Jewish people and not for the descendants of Noah. On the contrary, from that it was not repeated at Sinai, it was stated for the descendants of Noah and not for the Jewish people. There is nothing that is permitted to a Jew and forbidden to a gentile.
llm_translation: To the sons of Noah, and not given at Sinai - it was said for Israel and not for the sons of Noah. On the contrary, since it was not given at Sinai - it was said for the sons of Noah and not for Israel! It is evident from their laws that for Israel it is permitted, but for the nations it is forbidden.

hebrew_text: וְלָא? וַהֲרֵי יְפַת תּוֹאַר! הָתָם, מִשּׁוּם דְּלָאו בְּנֵי כִיבּוּשׁ נִינְהוּ.
human_translation: And not? But isn’t there beautiful woman, There, because they are not authorized to conquer.
llm_translation: And no? But behold, Yefet's beauty! There, because they are not sons of disgrace.

hebrew_text: וַהֲרֵי פָּחוֹת מִשָּׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה! הָתָם, מִשּׁוּם דְּלָאו בְּנֵי מְחִילָה נִינְהוּ.
human_translation: But isn’t less than the value of one peruta There it is because are not apt forgiveness
llm_translation: And behold, less than the value of a prutah! There, because they are not considered sons of a distinguished family.

hebrew_text: כׇּל מִצְוָה שֶׁנֶּאֶמְרָה לִבְנֵי נֹחַ וְנִישְׁנֵית בְּסִינַי, לָזֶה וְלָזֶה נֶאֶמְרָה.
human_translation: any mitzva that was stated with regard to the descendants of Noah and was repeated at Sinai was stated for this and for that
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Every commandment that was stated for the sons of Noah and repeated at Sinai, for this one and for that one it was stated.

hebrew_text: וַהֲרֵי מִילָה, שֶׁנֶּאֶמְרָה לִבְנֵי נֹחַ, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְאַתָּה אֶת בְּרִיתִי תִשְׁמֹר״, וְנִשְׁנֵית בְּסִינַי: ״וּבַיּוֹם הַשְּׁמִינִי יִמּוֹל״ – לְיִשְׂרָאֵל נֶאֶמְרָה וְלֹא לִבְנֵי נֹחַ.
human_translation: But isn’t there circumcision, which was stated with regard to descendants of Noah, As it is written “And as for you, you shall keep My covenant, And it was repeated at Sinai “And on the eighth day shall be circumcised” it was stated for the Jewish people and not for the descendants of Noah.
llm_translation: Behold circumcision, as it was said to the sons of Noah, as it is written: "But you, you must keep My covenant," and it was repeated at Sinai: "And on the eighth day he shall be circumcised" – it was said for Israel and not for the sons of Noah.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא לְמִישְׁרֵי שַׁבָּת הוּא דַּאֲתָא, ״בַּיּוֹם״ – וַאֲפִילּוּ בְּשַׁבָּת.
human_translation: That it comes to permit Shabbat. “on the day” and even on Shabbat.
llm_translation: That one for the purposes of Shabbat he came, "on the day" - and even on Shabbat.

hebrew_text: וַהֲרֵי פְּרִיָּה וּרְבִיָּה, שֶׁנֶּאֶמְרָה לִבְנֵי נֹחַ? דִּכְתִיב: ״וְאַתֶּם פְּרוּ וּרְבוּ״, וְנִשְׁנֵית בְּסִינַי: ״לֵךְ אֱמֹר לָהֶם שׁוּבוּ לָכֶם לְאׇהֳלֵיכֶם״. לְיִשְׂרָאֵל נֶאֶמְרָה וְלֹא לִבְנֵי נֹחַ!
human_translation: But isn’t there procreation, which was stated with regard to the descendants of Noah? As it is written: “And you, be fruitful and multiply, And it was repeated at Sinai, “Go say to them: Return to your tents” was stated for the Jewish people and not for the descendants of Noah.
llm_translation: Behold, "Peru uRevuah" (be fruitful and multiply), which was said to the sons of Noah? As it is written: "And you, be fruitful and multiply" (Genesis 9:7), and it was repeated at Sinai: "Go say to them, return to your tents" (Deuteronomy 5:27). It was said to Israel and not to the sons of Noah!

hebrew_text: הָהוּא, לְכׇל דָּבָר שֶׁבְּמִנְיָן צָרִיךְ מִנְיָן אַחֵר לְהַתִּירוֹ הוּא דַּאֲתָא.
human_translation: That it comes to That any matter that by vote requires another vote to permit it.
llm_translation: That one, for every matter that requires a count, needs another count to permit it. This is what he came to teach.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, כֹּל חֲדָא וַחֲדָא נָמֵי נֵימָא מִשּׁוּם מִילְּתָא אִיתְּנַי?
human_translation: If so, let us say each and every one it was repeated because of matter
llm_translation: If so, each and every one should be examined separately for the sake of the matter?

hebrew_text: הָכִי קָאָמַר: אַזְהָרָה מִיהְדָּר וּמִיתְנָא בַּהּ, לְמָה לִי?
human_translation: this is saying: a prohibition why do I then repeat
llm_translation: So it is stated: "A warning from a dwelling and from a basket, why do I need it?"

hebrew_text: וְאֵין לָנוּ אֶלָּא גִּיד הַנָּשֶׁה בִּלְבַד, וְאַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה. הָנֵי נָמֵי לָא אִיתְּנַי.
human_translation: And we have only the sciatic nerve and according to of Rabbi Yehuda. these also, were not repeated
llm_translation: And we have only the sciatic nerve alone, and according to the opinion of Rabbi Yehuda. These others do not agree.

hebrew_text: הָנֵי אִיתְּנַי לְשׁוּם מִילְּתָא בְּעָלְמָא, הָא לָא אִיתְּנַי כְּלָל.
human_translation: These were repeated for the sake of some matter. this was not repeated at all;
llm_translation: These were taught for the sake of a certain matter in general, but were not taught specifically.

hebrew_text: אִי בָּעֵית אֵימָא: מִילָה מֵעִיקָּרָא לְאַבְרָהָם הוּא דְּקָא מַזְהַר לֵיהּ רַחֲמָנָא, ״וְאַתָּה אֶת בְּרִיתִי תִשְׁמֹר אַתָּה וְזַרְעֲךָ אַחֲרֶיךָ לְדֹרֹתָם״. ״אַתָּה וְזַרְעֲךָ״ – אִין, אִינִישׁ אַחֲרִינָא – לָא.
human_translation: If you wish, say circumcision From the outset, it was Abraham, that the Merciful One commanded to “And as for you, you shall keep My covenant, you and your offspring after you, throughout their generations” “You and your offspring,” yes; another person, no.
llm_translation: If you wish, I will say: Circumcision is from the outset for Abraham, as the Merciful One warns him, "And you shall keep My covenant, you and your seed after you throughout their generations." "You and your seed" - not another person - no.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, בְּנֵי יִשְׁמָעֵאל לִחַיְּיבוּ? ״כִּי בְיִצְחָק יִקָּרֵא לְךָ זָרַע״.
human_translation: If that is so, the descendants of Ishmael should be obligated “For through Isaac, offspring shall be called yours”
llm_translation: Rather from now, the sons of Yishmael are obligated? "For in Yitzchak shall your seed be called."

hebrew_text: בְּנֵי עֵשָׂו לִחַיְּיבוּ. ״בְּיִצְחָק״ – וְלֹא כׇּל יִצְחָק.
human_translation: the descendants of Esau, should be obligated “Through Isaac [ beYitzḥak ],” but not all Isaac.
llm_translation: Sons of Esau obligated. "In Isaac" - and not all Isaac.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב אוֹשַׁעְיָא: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, בְּנֵי קְטוּרָה לָא לִחַיְּיבוּ? הָאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר אָבִין, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר חֲנִינָא: ״אֶת בְּרִיתִי הֵפַר״ – לְרַבּוֹת בְּנֵי קְטוּרָה.
human_translation: Rav Oshaya objects to this: If that is so, the descendants of Keturah, should not be obligated Rabbi Yosei bar Avin says, and some say Rabbi Yosei bar Ḥanina he has broken My covenant” to include the descendants of Keturah
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: Rav Oshaya objects to her: Rather, from now on, the sons of Ketura should not be liable? Didn't Rabbi Yosei bar Avin say, and some say Rabbi Yosei bar Hanina: "He has broken My covenant" - to include the sons of Ketura.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: אָדָם הָרִאשׁוֹן לֹא הוּתַּר לוֹ בָּשָׂר לַאֲכִילָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״לָכֶם יִהְיֶה לְאׇכְלָה וּלְכׇל חַיַּת הָאָרֶץ״, וְלֹא חַיַּת הָאָרֶץ לָכֶם.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Rav says: Meat was not permitted to Adam, the first for consumption, as it is written: for you it shall be for food, and for every animal of the earth, but the animals of the earth is not to you.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: The first man was not permitted to eat meat, as it is written: "To you it shall be for food, and to all the beasts of the earth," but not to you, beasts of the earth.

hebrew_text: וּכְשֶׁבָּאוּ בְּנֵי נֹחַ, הִתִּיר לָהֶם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כְּיֶרֶק עֵשֶׂב נָתַתִּי לָכֶם אֶת כֹּל״. יָכוֹל לֹא יְהֵא אֵבֶר מִן הַחַי נוֹהֵג בּוֹ? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אַךְ בָּשָׂר בְּנַפְשׁוֹ דָמוֹ לֹא תֹאכֵלוּ״. יָכוֹל אַף לִשְׁרָצִים? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אַךְ״.
human_translation: But when the children of Noah came, permitted them as it is stated: as the green herb I have given you all” might a limb from a living does not apply to the verse states: “Only flesh with its life, which is its blood, you shall not eat” might even to creeping animals; the verse states “only,”
llm_translation: When the sons of Noah came, He permitted for them, as it is stated: "Like the green herb I have given you everything." Could one say that a limb from a living animal is permissible for them? The verse teaches: "However, flesh with its life, its blood, you shall not eat." Could one also say that it is permissible for creeping creatures? The verse teaches: "However."

hebrew_text: וּמַאי תַּלְמוּדָא? אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: ״דָּמוֹ״ – מִי שֶׁדָּמוֹ חָלוּק מִבְּשָׂרוֹ, יָצְאוּ שְׁרָצִים שֶׁאֵין דָּמָם חָלוּק מִבְּשֶׁרָם.
human_translation: And what is the derivation? Rav Huna says: “its blood” whose blood is separate from their flesh. excludes creeping animals, whose blood is not separate from their flesh.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And what is the Talmud? Rav Huna said: "Its blood" - one whose blood is separate from his flesh, they have the status of creeping things whose blood is not separate from their flesh.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: ״וּרְדוּ בִּדְגַת הַיָּם״, מַאי לָאו, לַאֲכִילָה? לֹא, לִמְלָאכָה.
human_translation: raises an objection “And have dominion over the fish of the sea, What, is it not with regard to consumption, No, to labor.
llm_translation: Challenger: "And descend into the sea's fish." What is the reason why not for eating? No, for work.

hebrew_text: וְדָגִים בְּנֵי מְלָאכָה נִינְהוּ? אִין, כִּדְרַחֲבָה. דְּבָעֵי רַחֲבָה: הִנְהִיג בְּעִיזָּא וְשִׁיבּוּטָא – מַאי?
human_translation: But are fish capable of labor? Yes, in accordance with of Raḥava; as Raḥava asked drove a goat and a shibbuta what
llm_translation: Fish are considered items of labor? No, like a courtyard. The requirements of a courtyard: if one led a goat and a staff - what is the ruling?

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: ״וּבְעוֹף הַשָּׁמַיִם״, מַאי לָאו, לַאֲכִילָה? לָא, לִמְלָאכָה.
human_translation: Come hear and over the fowl of the air.” What, is it not to consumption? No, to labor.
llm_translation: Come and hear: "And in the fowl of the heavens," what is it for, not for eating? No, for work.

hebrew_text: וְעוֹפוֹת בְּנֵי מְלָאכָה נִינְהוּ? אִין, כִּדְבָעֵי רַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא: דָּשׁ בַּאֲוָוזִין וְתַרְנְגוֹלִין לְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה מַאי?
human_translation: But are birds capable of labor? Yes, as Rabba bar Rav Huna raises a dilemma: threshed with geese and chickens, what according to Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda?
llm_translation: Birds are considered offspring of labor? No, as the words of Rabbah bar Rav Huna: Dash in geese and chickens to Rabbi Yosei son of Rabbi Yehuda, what is it?

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: ״וּבְכׇל חַיָּה הָרֹמֶשֶׂת עַל הָאָרֶץ״. הָהוּא לְאֵתוֹיֵי נָחָשׁ הוּא דַּאֲתָא.
human_translation: Come hear and over every living thing that creeps upon the land.” That comes to include snake,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Ta shma: 'uv'chol chayah haromeset al ha'aretz.' Ha'hoo l'etoyei nachash hu d'ata." English translation: Come and hear: "And every creeping thing that creeps on the earth." That refers to the snake that came.

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן מְנַסְיָא אוֹמֵר: חֲבָל עַל שַׁמָּשׁ גָּדוֹל שֶׁאָבַד מִן הָעוֹלָם, שֶׁאִלְמָלֵא לֹא נִתְקַלֵּל נָחָשׁ, כׇּל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד מִיִּשְׂרָאֵל הָיוּ מִזְדַּמְּנִין לוֹ שְׁנֵי נְחָשִׁים טוֹבִים – אֶחָד מְשַׁגְּרוֹ לַצָּפוֹן וְאֶחָד מְשַׁגְּרוֹ לַדָּרוֹם, לְהָבִיא לוֹ סַנְדַּלְבּוֹנִים טוֹבִים וַאֲבָנִים טוֹבוֹת וּמַרְגָּלִיּוֹת. וְלֹא עוֹד, אֶלָּא שֶׁמַּפְשִׁילִין רְצוּעָה תַּחַת זְנָבוֹ וּמוֹצִיא בָּהּ עָפָר לְגִנָּתוֹ וּלְחוּרְבָּתוֹ.
human_translation: As it is taught Rabbi Shimon ben Menasya says: Woe over a great attendant that has been lost to the world; as had the snake not been cursed there would have been two fine snakes at the disposal of each and every one of the Jewish people. One he would send to the north, and one he would send to the south, to bring him precious sandalbonim , and precious stones and pearls. Moreover, attach a strap under tail and use it to take dirt out to his garden and to his ruin,
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Shimon ben Menasya says: Woe to the great sun that has been lost from the world, for if not, the serpent would not have been cursed. Each and every one of the Israelites would have been provided with two good serpents - one sending its venom to the north and the other sending its venom to the south, to bring him good sandals, good stones, and pearls. Moreover, they would even spread a carpet beneath its tail and bring forth dust for his garden and his palace.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי, הָיָה רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן תֵּימָא אוֹמֵר: אָדָם הָרִאשׁוֹן מֵיסֵב בְּגַן עֵדֶן הָיָה, וְהָיוּ מַלְאֲכֵי הַשָּׁרֵת צוֹלִין לוֹ בָּשָׂר וּמְסַנְּנִין לוֹ יַיִן. הֵצִיץ בּוֹ נָחָשׁ וְרָאָה בִּכְבוֹדוֹ, וְנִתְקַנֵּא בּוֹ. הָתָם בְּבָשָׂר הַיּוֹרֵד מִן הַשָּׁמַיִם.
human_translation: raises an objection Rabbi Yehuda ben Teima would say: Adam, the first would dine in the Garden of Eden, and the ministering angels would roast meat for him and strain wine for him. The snake glanced at him and saw his glory, and was jealous of him, There to meat that descended from heaven,
llm_translation: Challenger: Rabbi Yehuda ben Tema says: The first man sat in the Garden of Eden, and the ministering angels would roast meat for him and strain wine for him. A serpent glanced at him and saw his glory, and became jealous of him. There, with the flesh that descended from heaven.

hebrew_text: מִי אִיכָּא בָּשָׂר הַיּוֹרֵד מִן הַשָּׁמַיִם? אִין, כִּי הָא דְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן חֲלַפְתָּא הֲוָה קָאָזֵיל בְּאוֹרְחָא, פְּגַעוּ בֵּיהּ הָנָךְ אַרְיָוָתָא דַּהֲווֹ קָא נָהֲמִי לְאַפֵּיהּ. אֲמַר: ״הַכְּפִירִים שֹׁאֲגִים לַטָּרֶף״. נְחִיתוּ לֵיהּ תַּרְתֵּי אַטְמָתָא. חֲדָא אַכְלוּהָ וַחֲדָא שַׁבְקוּהָ. אַיְתְיַהּ וַאֲתָא לְבֵי מִדְרְשָׁא, בָּעֵי עֲלַהּ: דָּבָר טָמֵא הוּא זֶה אוֹ דָּבָר טָהוֹר? אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: אֵין דָּבָר טָמֵא יוֹרֵד מִן הַשָּׁמַיִם.
human_translation: Is there meat that descends from heaven? Yes, it is like this As Rabbi Shimon ben Ḥalafta was walking along the way, he encountered those lions that were roaring at him, He said: “The young lions roar after their prey, Two thighs descended for him. ate one and they left one. He took it and entered the study hall, inquired about it: Is this a kosher item or a non-kosher item? said to him: a non-kosher item does not descend from heaven.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Is there any flesh that descends from the sky? No, for it was when Rabbi Shimon ben Halaftha was walking on the road, a company of angels met him on the way, and they were saying, "The young lions roar after their prey." They gave him two bundles of meat; one they ate and one they left. He came to the study hall and asked about it: Is this an unclean thing or a clean thing? They said to him: There is no unclean thing that descends from the sky.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי מִינֵּיהּ רַבִּי זֵירָא מֵרַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: יָרְדָה לוֹ דְּמוּת חֲמוֹר, מַהוּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: יָארוּד נָאלָא! הָא אָמְרִי לֵיהּ: אֵין דָּבָר טָמֵא יוֹרֵד מִן הַשָּׁמַיִם.
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira asked Rabbi Abbahu: the likeness of a donkey had descended for him, what said to him: Foolish bird [ yarud nala ]. said to him a non-kosher item does not descend from heaven;
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Rabbi Zeira asked Rabbi Avahu: If the likeness of a donkey descended to him, what is the ruling? He said to him: 'Go down, O weasel!' They said to him: 'Nothing impure descends from the sky.'"

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: אַף עַל הַכִּישּׁוּף. מַאי טַעְמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן? דִּכְתִיב:
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says also concerning sorcery. What is the reasoning of Rabbi Shimon? As it is written:
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: Even regarding the eclipse. What is the reason of Rabbi Shimon? As it is written:

hebrew_text: ״מְכַשֵּׁפָה לֹא תְחַיֶּה״, וּכְתִיב: ״כׇּל שֹׁכֵב עִם בְּהֵמָה מוֹת יוּמָת״. כֹּל שֶׁיֶּשְׁנוֹ בִּכְלַל ״כׇּל שֹׁכֵב עִם בְּהֵמָה״ – יֶשְׁנוֹ בִּכְלַל ״מְכַשֵּׁפָה לֹא תְחַיֶּה״.
human_translation: “You shall not allow a witch to live” and it is written “Whoever lies with an animal shall be put to death” anyone who is included in “Whoever lies with an animal,” is included in “You shall not allow a witch to live.”
llm_translation: "‘A sorceress you shall not allow to live,’ yet it is written: ‘Whoever lies with an animal shall surely be put to death.’ Anyone included in the category of ‘whoever lies with an animal’ is included in the category of ‘a sorceress you shall not allow to live.’"

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: אַף עַל הַכִּלְאַיִם. מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל, דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״אֵת חֻקֹּתַי תִּשְׁמֹרוּ״ – חוּקִּים שֶׁחָקַקְתִּי לְךָ כְּבָר: ״בְּהֶמְתְּךָ לֹא תַרְבִּיעַ כִּלְאַיִם שָׂדְךָ לֹא תִזְרַע כִּלְאָיִם״.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar says also about diverse kinds. From where are these matters Shmuel says: which the verse states: “My statutes you shall keep. statutes that I have already instituted for you, “you shall not breed your animal with a diverse kind; you shall not sow your field with two kinds of seed.”
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar says: Even regarding kilayim. From where do we derive these matters? Shmuel said, as the verse states: "You shall observe My statutes" - statutes that I have decreed for you already: "You shall not let your cattle breed with a different kind; you shall not sow your field with mixed seed."

hebrew_text: מָה בְּהֶמְתְּךָ בְּהַרְבָּעָה, אַף שָׂדְךָ בְּהַרְכָּבָה. מָה בְּהֶמְתְּךָ בֵּין בָּאָרֶץ בֵּין בְּחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ, אַף שָׂדְךָ בֵּין בָּאָרֶץ בֵּין בְּחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ.
human_translation: Just as your animal with regard to breeding so too, your field with regard to grafting just as your animal both in Eretz and outside Eretz so too, your field both in Eretz and outside Eretz
llm_translation: Your field animal in a pen, so too your field in a wagon. Your field animal whether in the land or outside the land, so too your field whether in the land or outside the land.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה: ״וּשְׁמַרְתֶּם אֶת חֻקֹּתַי וְאֶת מִשְׁפָּטַי״ – חֻקִּים שֶׁחָקַקְתִּי לְךָ כְּבָר?
human_translation: If that is so, “You shall therefore keep My statutes and My ordinances” Statutes that I have already instituted for you.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rather from now on: "And you shall keep My statutes and My judgments" - statutes that I have decreed for you already?

hebrew_text: הָתָם – ״וּשְׁמַרְתֶּם אֶת חֻקֹּתַי״ דְּהַשְׁתָּא. הָכָא – ״אֶת חֻקֹּתַי תִּשְׁמֹרוּ״, חֻקִּים דְּמֵעִיקָּרָא תִּשְׁמֹרוּ.
human_translation: There “You shall therefore keep My statutes,” that now, here, “My statutes you shall keep,” statutes that from the outset you shall keep
llm_translation: There - "And you shall observe My statutes" - now. Here - "You shall observe My statutes," the statutes from the beginning you shall observe.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן קׇרְחָה כּוּ׳.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korḥa said
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korcha: "Ku."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב: אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב עַד שֶׁיְּבָרֵךְ שֵׁם בֶּן אַרְבַּע אוֹתִיּוֹת, לְאַפּוֹקֵי בֶּן שְׁתֵּי אוֹתִיּוֹת דְּלָא.
human_translation: Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov says: is not liable unless he blesses, the Tetragrammaton, to the exclusion of two-letter who is not
llm_translation: Rav Acha bar Yaakov said: He is not liable until he blesses the name with four letters, to exclude a name with only two letters.

hebrew_text: פְּשִׁיטָא! ״יַכֶּה יוֹסִי אֶת יוֹסִי״ תְּנַן? מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: מִילְּתָא בְּעָלְמָא הוּא דְּנָקֵט, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: obvious? We learned let Yosei smite Yosei, Lest you say mentions statement a mere teaches us
llm_translation: It is obvious! "Yakkeh Yosi et Yosi" we learned? What might you say: it is a simple matter that is being discussed, it is teaching us.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: אָמַר רַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: שֵׁם בֶּן אַרְבַּע אוֹתִיּוֹת נָמֵי שֵׁם הוּא.
human_translation: There are who say Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov says Conclude from Tetragrammaton is also a name
llm_translation: There are those who say: Rav Acha bar Yaakov said, learn from it: Shem, the son of four letters, his name is Shem.

hebrew_text: פְּשִׁיטָא? ״יַכֶּה יוֹסִי אֶת יוֹסִי״ תְּנַן! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: עַד דְּאִיכָּא שֵׁם רַבָּה, וּמִילְּתָא בְּעָלְמָא הוּא דְּנָקֵט – קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: obvious? We learned let Yosei smite Yosei. Lest you say unless there is a grand name and mentions statement a mere teaches us
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates as follows: "Peshita? 'Yakkeh Yosi et Yosi' we learned! What is the reasoning? Until there is a prominent name, and it is a general matter that is being discussed - this is what is implied to us."

hebrew_text: נִגְמַר הַדִּין כּוּ׳.
human_translation: the judgment is over,
llm_translation: The judgment is concluded.

hebrew_text: עוֹמְדִין מְנָלַן? אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק בַּר אַמֵּי: דְּאָמַר קְרָא, ״וְאֵהוּד בָּא אֵלָיו וְהוּא יֹשֵׁב בַּעֲלִיַּת הַמְּקֵרָה אֲשֶׁר לוֹ לְבַדּוֹ וַיֹּאמֶר אֵהוּד דְּבַר אֱלֹהִים לִי אֵלֶיךָ וַיָּקׇם מֵעַל הַכִּסֵּא״. וַהֲלֹא דְּבָרִים קַל וָחוֹמֶר? וּמָה עֶגְלוֹן מֶלֶךְ מוֹאָב שֶׁהוּא גּוֹי וְלֹא יָדַע אֶלָּא בְּכִינּוּי – עָמַד, יִשְׂרָאֵל וְשֵׁם הַמְפוֹרָשׁ – עַל אַחַת כַּמָּה וְכַמָּה!
human_translation: From where do we stand? Rabbi Yitzḥak bar Ami says: which the verse states “And Ehud came to him, and he was sitting by himself alone in his cool upper chamber. And Ehud said: I have a message from God [ Elohim ] to you. And he arose out of his seat” And are matters not a fortiori ? And if Eglon, king of Moab, who was a gentile and knew only by an appellation, stood all the more so a Jew the ineffable name.
llm_translation: Standing, from where do we learn? Rabbi Yitzchak bar Ami said: As the verse states, "And Ehud came to him while he was sitting alone in his cool upper chamber, and Ehud said, 'I have a message from God for you,' and he arose from his seat." Are these not logical arguments? If Eglon, king of Moab, who was a gentile and only knew through a hint - he stood up, how much more so Israel, with the name explicitly mentioned - how much more so!

hebrew_text: קוֹרְעִין, מְנָלַן? דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיָּבֹא אֶלְיָקִים בֶּן חִלְקִיָּהוּ [וְגוֹ׳] וְשֶׁבְנָא הַסֹּפֵר וְיוֹאָח בֶּן אָסָף הַמַּזְכִּיר אֶל חִזְקִיָּהוּ קְרוּעֵי בְגָדִים וַיַּגִּידוּ לוֹ אֵת דִּבְרֵי רַבְשָׁקֵה״.
human_translation: make a tear From where do we which is written: “Then came Eliakim, son of Hilkiah, and Shebna the scribe, and Joah, son of Asaph, the recorder, to Hezekiah with torn garments, and they told him Rabshakeh’s statement”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Kor'in, menalan? Diktiv: 'Vayavo El-yakim ben Chilkiyahu vego' v'Shebna hasofer v'Yoach ben Asaf hamazkir el Chizkiyahu k'ru'ei begadim vayagidu lo et divrei Ravshakhe.'" English translation: "They tear, from where? As it is written: 'And Eliakim son of Hilkiah etc. and Shebna the scribe and Joah son of Asaph the recorder came to Hezekiah with torn clothes and they told him the words of Rabshakeh.'"

hebrew_text: וְלֹא מְאַחִין – מְנָלַן?
human_translation: do not stitch From where do we
llm_translation: "And not prepare - from where?"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: אָתְיָא קְרִיעָה קְרִיעָה, כְּתִיב הָכָא ״קְרוּעֵי בְגָדִים״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם ״וֶאֱלִישָׁע רֹאֶה וְהוּא מְצַעֵק אָבִי אָבִי רֶכֶב יִשְׂרָאֵל וּפָרָשָׁיו וְלֹא רָאָהוּ עוֹד וַיַּחֲזֵק בִּבְגָדָיו וַיִּקְרָעֵם לִשְׁנַיִם קְרָעִים״. מִמַּשְׁמַע שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״וַיִּקְרָעֵם לִשְׁנַיִם״, אֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ שֶׁהֵן קְרָעִים? וּמָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״קְרָעִים״? מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהֵן קְרוּעִים לְעוֹלָם.
human_translation: Rabbi Abbahu says: derived tearing tearing It is written here, “With torn garments,” and it is written there: “And Elisha saw it, and he cried: My father, my father, the chariots of Israel and its horsemen. And he saw him no more, and he grabbed hold of his clothes and tore them into two pieces” From the meaning of that is stated: “And tore them into two,” do I not know that they are pieces? And why the verse state: “Pieces”? teaches that they torn forever;
llm_translation: Rabbi Avahu said: It is derived, tearing tearing, it is written here "torn garments," and it is written there "And Elisha was seeing and he was crying, my father my father, the chariot of Israel and its horsemen, and he did not see him anymore, and he took hold of his garments and tore them into two torn pieces." From the fact that it says "and he tore them into two," I do not know that they are torn? And what is the Talmud teaching by saying "torn pieces"? It teaches that they are torn forever.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אֶחָד הַשּׁוֹמֵעַ, וְאֶחָד שׁוֹמֵעַ מִפִּי שׁוֹמֵעַ – חַיָּיב לִקְרוֹעַ. וְהָעֵדִים אֵין חַיָּיבִין לִקְרוֹעַ, שֶׁכְּבָר קָרְעוּ בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁשָּׁמְעוּ.
human_translation: The Sages taught: Both one who hears and hears from heard obligated to make a tear But the witnesses are not obligated to make a tear as they already made a tear when they heard
llm_translation: The Sages taught: One who hears, and one who hears from the mouth of the hearer - is obligated to read. But witnesses are not obligated to read, for they already read at the time they heard.

hebrew_text: וְכִי קָרְעוּ בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁשָּׁמְעוּ, מַאי הָוֵי? הָא קָא שָׁמְעִי הַשְׁתָּא! לָא סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיְהִי כִּשְׁמֹעַ הַמֶּלֶךְ חִזְקִיָּהוּ אֶת דִּבְרֵי רַבְשָׁקֵה וַיִּקְרַע אֶת בְּגָדָיו״. הַמֶּלֶךְ חִזְקִיָּהוּ קָרַע, וְהֵם לֹא קָרְעוּ.
human_translation: And if they made a tear when they heard what of it? Aren’t they hearing now? not enter your mind as it is written: “And it came to pass, when King Hezekiah heard the statement of Rabshakeh, that he tore his clothes” King Hezekiah tore but those did not tear
llm_translation: And if they tore at the time they heard, what is the ruling? He is hearing now! It is not in your mind, as it is written: "And it came to pass, when King Hezekiah heard it, that he tore his clothes." King Hezekiah tore, but they did not tear.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הַשּׁוֹמֵעַ אַזְכָּרָה מִפִּי הַגּוֹי אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב לִקְרוֹעַ. וְאִם תֹּאמַר: רַבְשָׁקֵה – יִשְׂרָאֵל מוּמָר הָיָה.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: One who hears a mention from a gentile is not obligated to make a tear And if you say Rabshakeh was an apostate Jew.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: One who hears a mention from the mouth of a gentile is not obligated to rend his garments. And if you say: "Ravshakay - Yisrael was a rebel."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: אֵין קוֹרְעִין אֶלָּא עַל שֵׁם הַמְיוּחָד בִּלְבַד, לְאַפּוֹקֵי כִּינּוּי דְּלָא.
human_translation: And Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: One makes a tear only for the ineffable name to the exclusion of an appellation which not
llm_translation: And Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: One may only tear clothing over the name of the deceased alone, to exclude a symbolic tearing done for other reasons.

hebrew_text: וּפְלִיגִי דְּרַבִּי חִיָּיא בְּתַרְוַיְיהוּ, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא: הַשּׁוֹמֵעַ אַזְכָּרָה בִּזְמַן הַזֶּה אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב לִקְרוֹעַ, שֶׁאִם אִי אַתָּה אוֹמֵר כֵּן – נִתְמַלֵּא כׇּל הַבֶּגֶד קְרָעִים.
human_translation: And disagrees with Rav Ḥiyya with regard to two As Rabbi Ḥiyya says: One who hears a mention nowadays is not obligated to make a tear, as if you do not say so, the entire garment will be full of tears.
llm_translation: And they disputed, Rabbi Chiya on both of them, as Rabbi Chiya said: One who hears the mention nowadays is not obligated to rend, for if you say so - all the garments would be torn.

hebrew_text: מִמַּאן? אִילֵימָא מִיִּשְׂרָאֵל, מִי פְּקִירִי כּוּלֵּי הַאי? אֶלָּא פְּשִׁיטָא, מִגּוֹי. וְאִי שֵׁם הַמְיוּחָד, מִי גְּמִירִי? אֶלָּא לָאו, בְּכִינּוּי.
human_translation: From whom If we say from a Jew, are irreverent to such an extent Rather, obvious from a gentile. And if the ineffable name, have learned Rather, is it not by an appellation
llm_translation: From whom? If you say from Israel, are all the poor of this place destitute? Rather, it is obvious, from the nations. And if the name is specific, who is the one who learns? Rather, no, it is a nickname.

hebrew_text: וּשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: בִּזְמַן הַזֶּה הוּא דְּלָא, הָא מֵעִיקָּרָא – חַיָּיב. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: And conclude from it it is nowadays that, not but initially, obligated conclude from it
llm_translation: And hear from it: In this time, that is not, from the outset - liable. Hear from it.

hebrew_text: הַשֵּׁנִי אוֹמֵר: ״אַף אֲנִי כָּמוֹהוּ״. אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ, ״אַף אֲנִי כָּמוֹהוּ״ כָּשֵׁר בְּדִינֵי מָמוֹנוֹת וּבְדִינֵי נְפָשׁוֹת, וּמַעֲלָה הוּא דַּעֲבוּד רַבָּנַן. וְהָכָא, כֵּיוָן דְּלָא אֶפְשָׁר, אוֹקְמוּהָ רַבָּנַן אַדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא.
human_translation: the second says: I too as he Reish Lakish says: Conclude from it I too as he valid in monetary law and in capital law. And is a higher standard that the Sages instituted, and here, since it is not possible the Sages established according to Torah law
llm_translation: The second one says: "I too am like him." Reish Lakish said: Learn from it, "I too am like him" is valid in matters of monetary law and matters of life, and it is a Rabbinic enactment. And here, since it is not possible, the Rabbis established it based on Torah law.

hebrew_text: דְּאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ פָּסוּל, הָכָא, מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא אֶפְשָׁר, קָטְלִינַן לְגַבְרָא?
human_translation: As if it enters your mind not valid here, would we execute the man because it is not possible
llm_translation: If it enters your mind that it is invalid, here, because it is not possible, should we kill a person?

hebrew_text: וְהַשְּׁלִישִׁי אוֹמֵר: ״אַף אֲנִי כָּמוֹהוּ״. סְתָמָא כְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, דְּמַקֵּישׁ שְׁלֹשָׁה לִשְׁנַיִם.
human_translation: And the third says: I too as he unattributed in accordance with Rabbi Akiva, who compares three to two.
llm_translation: The third one says: "I too am like him." Presumably like Rabbi Akiva, who compares three to two.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הָעוֹבֵד עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה: אֶחָד הָעוֹבֵד, וְאֶחָד הַמְזַבֵּחַ, וְאֶחָד הַמְקַטֵּר, וְאֶחָד הַמְנַסֵּךְ, וְאֶחָד הַמִּשְׁתַּחֲוֶה, וְאֶחָד הַמְקַבְּלוֹ עָלָיו לֶאֱלוֹהַּ, וְהָאוֹמֵר לוֹ ״אֵלִי אַתָּה״.
human_translation: One who worships idols one who worships and one who slaughters and one who burns and one who pours a libation and one who bows and one who accepts upon himself as a god, and one who says to You are my god.
