llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who performs foreign worship - one who serves, and one who sacrifices, and one who offers incense, and one who pours a libation, and one who prostrates, and one who accepts upon himself the yoke of Heaven, and one who says to him, "You are my god."

hebrew_text: אֲבָל הַמְגַפֵּף, וְהַמְנַשֵּׁק, וְהַמְכַבֵּד, וְהַמְרַבֵּץ, וְהַמְרַחֵץ, וְהַסָּךְ, וְהַמַּלְבִּישׁ, וְהַמַּנְעִיל – עוֹבֵר בְּלֹא תַעֲשֶׂה. הַנּוֹדֵר בִּשְׁמוֹ, וְהַמְקַיֵּים בִּשְׁמוֹ – עוֹבֵר בְּלֹא תַעֲשֶׂה.
human_translation: But one who hugs or one who kisses or one who cleans or one who sprays or one who washes or one who rubs or one who dresses or one who puts its shoes on transgresses a prohibition one who vows in name and one who affirms in its name, transgresses a prohibition.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: But one who claps, and one who kisses, and one who bows, and one who spreads a bed, and one who washes, and one who anoints, and one who dresses, and one who shoes – transgresses a negative commandment. One who vows in his name, and one who fulfills in his name – transgresses a negative commandment.

hebrew_text: הַפּוֹעֵר עַצְמוֹ לְבַעַל פְּעוֹר – זוֹ הִיא עֲבוֹדָתָהּ. הַזּוֹרֵק אֶבֶן לְמַרְקוּלִיס – זוֹ הִיא עֲבוֹדָתָהּ.
human_translation: One who defecates before Ba’al-Peor that is its worship. one who throws a stone at Mercury that is its worship.
llm_translation: The one who breaks his bone for Baal Peor - this is its worship. The one who throws a stone to Merkulis - this is its worship.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי ״אֶחָד הָעוֹבֵד״?
human_translation: What One who worships?
llm_translation: Gemara: What is the meaning of "Echad HaOved"?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה: הָכִי קָאָמַר, אֶחָד הָעוֹבֵד כְּדַרְכָּהּ, וְאֶחָד הַמְזַבֵּחַ, וְאֶחָד הַמְקַטֵּר, וְאֶחָד הַמְנַסֵּךְ, וְאֶחָד הַמִּשְׁתַּחֲוֶה, וַאֲפִילּוּ שֶׁלֹּא כְּדַרְכָּהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya says this is saying: One who worships in its manner and one who slaughters and one who burns and one who pours and the one who bows and even not manner
llm_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya said: So did he say, one who serves as usual, and one who sacrifices, and one who burns incense, and one who pours libations, and one who prostrates, even if not as usual.

hebrew_text: וְלִיחְשׁוֹב נָמֵי זוֹרֵק? אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: זוֹרֵק הַיְינוּ מְנַסֵּךְ, דִּכְתִיב ״בַּל אַסִּיךְ נִסְכֵּיהֶם מִדָּם״.
human_translation: And let also count sprinkling Abaye says: Sprinkling is pouring as it is written: “I will not pour their libations of blood”
llm_translation: And to think, does he pour? Abaye said: Pouring means libation, as it is written, "I will not pour out their drink offerings of blood."

hebrew_text: מְנָהָנֵי מִילֵּי?
human_translation: From where are these matters
llm_translation: What are these words?

hebrew_text: דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן: אִילּוּ נֶאֱמַר ״זֹבֵחַ יׇחֳרָם״, הָיִיתִי אוֹמֵר בְּזוֹבֵחַ קֳדָשִׁים בַּחוּץ הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר. תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״לָאֱלֹהִים״ – בְּזוֹבֵחַ לַעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר.
human_translation: As the Sages taught If it were stated: One who sacrifices shall be utterly destroyed, I would have said the verse speaks of one who slaughters a sacrificial outside the verse states: “To the gods,” the verse speaks of one who slaughters to an idol.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: If it had only said, "One who sacrifices shall be utterly destroyed," I would have said that the verse is speaking about sacrificing holy offerings outside the Temple. The verse teaches us by saying, "to God" - the verse is speaking about sacrificing to foreign worship.

hebrew_text: אֵין לִי אֶלָּא בְּזוֹבֵחַ, מְקַטֵּר וּמְנַסֵּךְ מִנַּיִין? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״בִּלְתִּי לַה׳ לְבַדּוֹ״. רִיקֵּן הָעֲבוֹדוֹת כּוּלָּן לַשֵּׁם הַמְיוּחָד.
human_translation: I only one who slaughters From where burns or pours the verse states: “Except to the Lord alone”; emptied out, all the rites to the ineffable name
llm_translation: I have only in a sacrifice, to burn and to pour, from where? Scripture says: "Except to the Lord alone." All the empty services are for the sake of the unique Name.

hebrew_text: לְפִי שֶׁיָּצְאָה זְבִיחָה לִידּוֹן בַּעֲבוֹדוֹת פְּנִים, מִנַּיִין לְרַבּוֹת הִשְׁתַּחֲוָאָה?
human_translation: Since slaughter is singled out to derive with regard to rites inside from where includes bowing
llm_translation: According to the fact that a slaughter offering has emerged to be judged in the service of the inner sanctum, from where is there to include prostration?

hebrew_text: תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וַיֵּלֶךְ וַיַּעֲבֹד אֱלֹהִים אֲחֵרִים וַיִּשְׁתַּחוּ לָהֶם״, וּסְמִיךְ לֵיהּ: ״וְהוֹצֵאתָ אֶת הָאִישׁ הַהוּא וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: the verse states: “And has gone and served other gods and bowed to them” and near it “Then you shall bring forth that man
llm_translation: The Talmud teaches: "And he went and served other gods and worshiped them," and it is juxtaposed with: "And you shall take that man, etc."

hebrew_text: עוֹנֶשׁ שָׁמַעְנוּ, אַזְהָרָה מִנַּיִין? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״כִּי לֹא תִשְׁתַּחֲוֶה לְאֵל אַחֵר״.
human_translation: We have heard punishment from where prohibition the verse states: “For you shall bow to no other god”
llm_translation: Punishment we heard, warning from where? Scripture says: "For you shall not bow down to another god."

hebrew_text: יָכוֹל שֶׁאֲנִי מְרַבֶּה הַמְגַפֵּף וְהַמְנַשֵּׁק וְהַמַּנְעִיל? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״זֹבֵחַ״.
human_translation: might that I should include one who hugs or one who kisses or one who puts its shoes on the verse states: “One who sacrifices
llm_translation: I am able to increase the one who claps, kisses, and wears shoes? The verse says "sacrifices."

hebrew_text: זְבִיחָה בַּכְּלָל הָיְתָה, וְלָמָּה יָצְאָה? לְהַקִּישׁ אֵלֶיהָ וְלוֹמַר לָךְ: מָה זְבִיחָה מְיוּחֶדֶת שֶׁהִיא עֲבוֹדַת פְּנִים וְחַיָּיבִין עָלֶיהָ מִיתָה, אַף כֹּל שֶׁהִיא עֲבוֹדַת פְּנִים וְחַיָּיבִין עָלֶיהָ מִיתָה.
human_translation: slaughter was included and why was it singled out to compare to it and say to you: Just as slaughter is notable that it is rite inside and are liable the death penalty for it, so too, any that is rite inside and are liable the death penalty for it.
llm_translation: Sacrifice in general was, and why did it go out? To compare it and to say to you: Just as a unique sacrifice that is an inner service and incurs death penalty, so too any sacrifice that is an inner service and incurs death penalty.

hebrew_text: יָצְאָה הִשְׁתַּחֲוָאָה לִידּוֹן בְּעַצְמָהּ, יָצְאָה זְבִיחָה לִידּוֹן עַל הַכְּלָל כּוּלּוֹ.
human_translation: bowing is singled out to derive itself, slaughter is singled out to derive with regard to the entire category,
llm_translation: She went out to be judged by herself, she went out to be judged on the entirety of the principle.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: הָיִיתִי אוֹמֵר בְּזוֹבֵחַ קֳדָשִׁים בַּחוּץ הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר. זוֹבֵחַ קֳדָשִׁים בַּחוּץ כָּרֵת הוּא!
human_translation: The Master said I would have said the verse speaks of one who slaughters a sacrificial outside one who slaughters a sacrificial outside is karet ,
llm_translation: Master said: I used to say regarding slaughtering holy offerings outside the Temple, the Scripture speaks. Slaughtering holy offerings outside the Temple is a violation of karet!

hebrew_text: סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: כִּי אַתְרוֹ בֵּיהּ – קְטָלָא, כִּי לָא אַתְרוֹ בֵּיהּ – כָּרֵת. קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: enter your mind to say when warned the death when they did not warn him karet . teaches us
llm_translation: I will ascend to your understanding: If it is found in it - execution, if it is not found in it - excision. This is what we have heard.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא בַּר רַב חָנָן לְאַבָּיֵי: אֵימָא, יָצְאָה הִשְׁתַּחֲוָאָה לְלַמֵּד עַל הַכְּלָל כּוּלּוֹ.
human_translation: Rava bar Rav Ḥanan said to Abaye: Say bowing is singled out to teach, with regard to the entire category,
llm_translation: Rava son of Rav Hanan said to Abbaye: Say, she went out bowing to teach about the entire principle.

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא: זוֹבֵחַ לְמָה לִי? לְגוּפֵיהּ, דִּמְחַשְּׁבִין מֵעֲבוֹדָה לַעֲבוֹדָה.
human_translation: And if you would say why do I slaughter for itself, that one can have intention from rite to rite.
llm_translation: And if you will say: "Why do I need a slaughterer?" For himself, as they are considered from one service to another service.

hebrew_text: דְּאִיתְּמַר: הַשּׁוֹחֵט בְּהֵמָה לִזְרוֹק דָּמָהּ לַעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה וּלְהַקְטִיר חֶלְבָּהּ לַעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה, רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר:
human_translation: As it was stated one who slaughters an animal to sprinkle its blood in idol worship or to burn its fat in idol worship, Rabbi Yoḥanan says:
llm_translation: It was taught: One who slaughters an animal in order to sprinkle its blood for idolatrous worship, and to offer its fat for idolatrous worship, Rabbi Yochanan said:

hebrew_text: אֲסוּרָה, וְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר: מוּתֶּרֶת.
human_translation: prohibited, And Reish Lakish says: permitted.
llm_translation: Prohibited, and Reish Lakish said: Permitted.

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, אֶלָּא לְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ בָּעֵי קְרָא.
human_translation: According to Rabbi Yoḥanan, this works out well. But according to Reish Lakish, one needs verse
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Hanicha to Rabbi Yochanan, rather to Reish Lakish seeks a verse."

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב פָּפָּא: וּלְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן לָא בָּעֵי קְרָא? עַד כָּאן לָא קָא אָסַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אֶלָּא בְּהֵמָה, אֲבָל גַּבְרָא לָא בַּר קְטָלָא הוּא! וַאֲתָא קְרָא לְחַיּוֹבֵי גַּבְרָא לִקְטָלָא.
human_translation: Rav Pappa objects to this: And according to Rabbi Yoḥanan, does one not need a verse Rabbi Yoḥanan only prohibits animal; but the man not be liable the death And the verse comes to render the man liable the death
llm_translation: The Gemara challenges him: Rav Papa: And according to Rabbi Yochanan, does he not require a verse? Up to this point, Rabbi Yochanan only prohibited with regard to an animal, but with regard to a man, it is not a matter of prohibition! And a verse came to obligate with regard to a man for prohibition.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִיקָא: וּלְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ, מִי בָּעֵי קְרָא? עַד כָּאן לָא קָא שָׁרֵי רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אֶלָּא בְּהֵמָה, אֲבָל גַּבְרָא בַּר קְטָלָא הוּא! מִידֵּי דְּהָוֵה אַמִּשְׁתַּחֲוֶה לְהַר, דְּהַר מוּתָּר וְעוֹבְדוֹ בְּסַיִיף.
human_translation: Rav Aḥa, son of Rav Ika, objects to And according to Reish Lakish, does one need a verse Reish Lakish only permits animal; but the man is liable to the death just as is one who bows to a mountain, as mountain is permitted, but the one who worshipped it by sword.
llm_translation: Challenges her Rav Acha son of Rav Ika: And to Reish Lakish, who needs a verse? Until here, Reish Lakish did not permit except for an animal, but a man, son of a murderer he is! Since he would prostrate himself to the mountain, for a mountain is permitted and one may serve it with a sword.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַחָא מִדִּפְתִּי לְרָבִינָא: לְמַאי דְּקָאָמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא בַּר רַב חָנָן לְאַבָּיֵי, אֵימָא יָצְאָה הִשְׁתַּחֲוָאָה לְלַמֵּד עַל הַכְּלָל כּוּלּוֹ, ״אֵיכָה יַעַבְדוּ״ לְמַעוֹטֵי מַאי?
human_translation: Rav Aḥa of Difti said to Ravina: According to what Rava bar Rav Ḥanan said to Abaye, say bowing was singled out to teach, with regard to the entire category, how do serve to exclude what?
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Acha, from Difti to Ravina: For what is Rava son of Rav Chanana saying to Abbaye, say, "Perhaps she went out to prostrate herself to teach the entire principle, 'How can they serve?'" What is excluded?

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא: לְמַעוֹטֵי הַפּוֹעֵר עַצְמוֹ לְזוֹבְחִים? מֵהִשְׁתַּחֲוָאָה נָפְקָא! מָה הִשְׁתַּחֲוָאָה דֶּרֶךְ כִּיבּוּד, אַף כֹּל דֶּרֶךְ כִּיבּוּד.
human_translation: And if you would say to exclude one who defecates before sacrificing it is derived from bowing Just as bowing is an honorable so too, any honorable
llm_translation: And if you say: to exclude the one who is lame from the sacrifices? It emerges from prostration! Just as prostration is a form of honor, so too is everything a form of honor.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, לְמַעוֹטֵי הַפּוֹעֵר עַצְמוֹ לְמַרְקוּלִיס. סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: הוֹאִיל וַעֲבוֹדָתוֹ בִּזָּיוֹן הוּא, אַף כֹּל בִּזָּיוֹן? קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: Rather, to exclude one who defecates before Mercury, enter your mind to say since worship is degradation, so too, any degradation teaches us
llm_translation: Rather, to exclude the Po'er himself for Markulis. The reason for your opinion, I say: Since his service is with disgrace, is everything with disgrace? This is what we hear.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא הָא דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: מִנַּיִן לַזּוֹבֵחַ בְּהֵמָה לְמַרְקוּלִיס שֶׁהוּא חַיָּיב? שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְלֹא יִזְבְּחוּ עוֹד אֶת זִבְחֵיהֶם לַשְּׂעִירִם״.
human_translation: But that which Rabbi Eliezer says: From where that sacrifices an animal to Mercury is liable? As it is stated: “And they shall no longer sacrifice their sacrifices to the satyrs”
llm_translation: Rather, this that Rabbi Eliezer said: From where do we derive that one who slaughters an animal for Markulis is liable? As it is stated: "And they shall no longer sacrifice their sacrifices to the goat demons."

hebrew_text: אִם אֵינוֹ עִנְיָן לִכְדַרְכָּהּ, דִּכְתִיב ״אֵיכָה יַעַבְדוּ״, תְּנֵיהוּ עִנְיָן לְשֶׁלֹּא כְּדַרְכָּהּ.
human_translation: If is not matter of in its manner, as is written “How do serve apply it to matter not in its manner,
llm_translation: If it is not relevant to its usual manner, as it is written "How can they serve," both of them are relevant, one in its usual manner.

hebrew_text: שֶׁלֹּא כְּדַרְכָּהּ, מֵהִשְׁתַּחֲוָאָה נָפְקָא.
human_translation: it is derived not in its manner from bowing.
llm_translation: In the way of her, from bowing out went.

hebrew_text: הָתָם, בְּזוֹבֵחַ לְהַכְעִיס.
human_translation: There, to one who sacrifices in order to express insolence
llm_translation: There, in the case of one who slaughters to provoke.

hebrew_text: רַב הַמְנוּנָא אִירְכַסוּ לֵיהּ תּוֹרֵי. פְּגַע בֵּיהּ רַבָּה, רְמָא לֵיהּ מַתְנְיָתִין אַהֲדָדֵי: תְּנַן ״הָעוֹבֵד עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה״ – עוֹבֵד אִין, אוֹמֵר לָא. וְהָאֲנַן תְּנַן: ״הָאוֹמֵר ׳אֶעֱבוֹד׳, ׳אֵלֵךְ וְאֶעֱבוֹד׳, ׳נֵלֵךְ וְנַעֲבוֹד׳״?
human_translation: Rav Hamnuna lost his oxen Rabba met him raised between mishnayot . We learned one who worships idols worships yes, says not But didn’t we learn One who says: I will worship I will go and worship Let us go and worship
llm_translation: Rav Hamnuna was walking along the road. Rabba met him, and they exchanged greetings. Rav Hamnuna quoted a Mishnah to him: "One who performs idol worship - if he says 'I will worship,' 'I will go and worship,' or 'let us go and worship'?"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בְּאוֹמֵר ״אֵינִי מְקַבְּלוֹ עָלַי אֶלָּא בַּעֲבוֹדָה״.
human_translation: said to him: to one who states: I accept upon myself only through worship.
llm_translation: He said to him: When one says, "I only accept it upon myself through service."

hebrew_text: רַב יוֹסֵף אָמַר: תַּנָּאֵי שָׁקְלַתְּ מֵעָלְמָא? תַּנָּאֵי הִיא, דְּתַנְיָא: הָאוֹמֵר ״בּוֹאוּ וְעִבְדוּנִי״ – רַבִּי מֵאִיר מְחַיֵּיב, וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה פּוֹטֵר.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: have you removed the tanna’im from the world? It is tanna’im , as it is taught one who says: come and worship me, Rabbi Meir deems liable and Rabbi Yehuda deems exempt.
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: Did you learn it from tradition? It is a tradition, as it was taught: One who says, "Come and serve me" - Rabbi Meir obligates, and Rabbi Yehuda exempts.

hebrew_text: הֵיכָא דִּפְלַחוּ כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא – לָא פְּלִיגִי, דִּכְתִיב: ״לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה לְךָ פֶסֶל״. כִּי פְּלִיגִי – בְּדִיבּוּרָא בְּעָלְמָא. רַבִּי מֵאִיר סָבַר: דִּיבּוּרָא מִילְּתָא הִיא, וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה סָבַר: דִּיבּוּרָא לָאו מִילְּתָא הִיא.
human_translation: where worshiped everyone agrees as it is written: “You shall not make yourself a graven image” When they disagree in mere speech. Rabbi Meir holds speech is matter, and Rabbi Yehuda holds speech is nothing.
llm_translation: Here where they argued, the whole world - they do not argue, as it is written: "You shall not make for yourself a graven image." If they argue - it is in general speech. Rabbi Meir holds: speech is a significant matter, and Rabbi Yehuda holds: speech is not a significant matter.

hebrew_text: הֲדַר אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: לָאו מִילְּתָא הִיא דַּאֲמַרִי, דַּאֲפִילּוּ לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה בְּדִיבּוּרָא נָמֵי חַיּוֹבֵי מְחַיֵּיב. דִּתְנַן, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: לְעוֹלָם אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב עַד שֶׁיֹּאמַר ״אֶעֱבוֹד״, ״אֵלֵךְ וְאֶעֱבוֹד״, ״נֵלֵךְ וְנַעֲבוֹד״.
human_translation: Rav Yosef then said What I said is not correct, as even according to Rabbi Yehuda, one is deemed liable for speech as well. As we learned Rabbi Yehuda says: Actually, is not liable unless he says: I will worship, I will go and worship, Let us go and worship.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: Hadr amar Rav Yosef: Lav milta hi da'amari, da'afilu l'Rabbi Yehuda b'diburah namei chayovei mechayev. Ditnan, Rabbi Yehuda omer: Le'olam einu chayav ad sheyomar "e'evoed", "elech ve'e'evoed", "nelech ve'na'evoed". English translation: Hadr said Rav Yosef: It is not a matter that they said, for even according to Rabbi Yehuda in his speech, he obligates one with the use of words. For we learned in a Mishnah, Rabbi Yehuda says: One is never obligated until he says "I will serve," "I will go and serve," "We will go and serve."

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי קָמִיפַּלְגִי? בְּמֵסִית לְעַצְמוֹ וְאָמְרִי לֵיהּ ״אִין״ קָמִיפַּלְגִי. מָר סָבַר, מֵסִית לְעַצְמוֹ – שָׁמְעִי לֵיהּ, וְ״אִין״ דְּקָאָמְרִי לֵיהּ קוּשְׁטָא הוּא; וּמָר סָבַר, מֵסִית לְעַצְמוֹ – לָא שָׁמְעִי לֵיהּ, מֵימָר אָמְרִי:
human_translation: with regard to what disagree? They disagree with regard to incites him, and say to him: Yes, One holds one incites to him, listen to him, and Yes, that they say to him, is sincere. And one holds one incites to him, not listen to him, they say
llm_translation: With what does he argue? With regard to inciting himself, and they say to him, "No" he argues. The Master holds, inciting himself - listen to him, and the "No" that they say to him is a valid argument; and the Master holds, inciting himself - do not listen to him, the statement is said.

hebrew_text: מַאי שְׁנָא אִיהוּ מִינַּן דִּידַן? וְ״אִין״ דְּקָאָמְרִי, אַחוֹכֵי עֲלֵיהּ.
human_translation: what is he different from us? And that they say to him: Yes, they ridicule him.
llm_translation: What is different about him from us? And the "no" that they are saying, they are mistaken about it.

hebrew_text: וּמַתְנְיָתִין: כָּאן בְּיָחִיד הַנִּיסָּת, כָּאן בְּרַבִּים הַנִּיסָּתִים. יָחִיד – לָא מִימְּלַךְ, וְטָעֵי בָּתְרֵיהּ; רַבִּים – מִימַּלְכִי, וְלָא טָעוּ בָּתְרֵיהּ.
human_translation: And mishnayot There, to an individual incited; here, to an incited multitude An individual does not change his mind, and he goes astray after a multitude change their minds, and do not go astray after
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Umatnitin: kan b'yachid hanisat, kan b'rabim hanisatim. Yachid - la mimalach, v'ta'ei batrei; rabim - mimalchi, v'lo tau batrei." English translation: "And the Mishnah teaches: here in the case of an individual who was tested, here in the case of many who were tested. An individual - does not rule, and errs in his judgment; many - do rule, and do not err in their judgment."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: מְנָא אָמֵינָא לַהּ? דִּכְתִיב ״לֹא תֹאבֶה לוֹ וְלֹא תִשְׁמַע אֵלָיו״. הָא אָבָה וְשָׁמַע – חַיָּיב.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: From where do I say As it is written “You shall not approve of him, nor listen to him” approved and listened liable
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: From where do I say this to her? As it is written, "You shall not desire him, and you shall not listen to him." If he desired and listened - he is liable.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: מִי שָׁאנֵי בֵּין נִיסָּת דְּרַבִּים לְנִיסָּת יָחִיד? וְהָתַנְיָא: ״כִּי יְסִיתְךָ אָחִיךָ בֶן אִמֶּךָ״ – אֶחָד יָחִיד הַנִּיסָּת וְאֶחָד רַבִּים הַנִּיסָּתִים, וְהוֹצִיא הַכָּתוּב יָחִיד מִכְּלַל רַבִּים וְרַבִּים מִכְּלַל יָחִיד.
human_translation: Abaye raised an objection to Is a difference between an incited multitude and an individual incited? But isn’t it taught “If your brother, the son of your mother, incites you both an individual incited and an incited multitude but the verse singles out the individual from the category of the multitude, and the multitude from the category of the individual.
llm_translation: He raised an objection to him, Abaye: Who is different between a temptation of the public and a temptation of an individual? And it was taught: "If your brother, the son of your mother, entices you" - one individual who tempts and one public who tempts, and the Scripture included an individual in the category of the public and the public in the category of the individual.

hebrew_text: יָחִיד מִכְּלַל רַבִּים, לְהַחְמִיר עַל גּוּפוֹ וּלְהָקֵל עַל מָמוֹנוֹ.
human_translation: An individual from the category of multitude to render to body stringent. And to render the property of lenient,
llm_translation: Individual from general public, to be stringent on his body and to be lenient on his money.

hebrew_text: רַבִּים מִכְּלַל יָחִיד, לְהָקֵל עַל גּוּפָם וּלְהַחְמִיר עַל מָמוֹנָם.
human_translation: multitude from the category of an individual to render to the bodies of lenient and to render of their property stringent,
llm_translation: Many from the general public, to be lenient with their bodies and to be stringent with their money.

hebrew_text: בְּהָא מִילְּתָא הוּא דְּשָׁאנֵי, אֲבָל בְּכֹל מִילֵּי כִּי הֲדָדֵי נִינְהוּ.
human_translation: with regard to this matter, is different but with regard to all matters they are the same.
llm_translation: In this matter, they differ, but in all other matters, they are in agreement.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: כָּאן – בְּנִיסָּת מִפִּי עַצְמוֹ, כָּאן – בְּנִיסָּת מִפִּי אֲחֵרִים. מִפִּי עַצְמוֹ – מִימְּלֵךְ, מִפִּי אֲחֵרִים – גְּרִיר בָּתְרַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: Rather, Abaye said Here, to incited by himself, there, to incited by others. on his own change his mind, by others is drawn after them
llm_translation: Rather, Abaye said: Here - through a miracle from his own mouth, here - through a miracle from the mouths of others. From his own mouth - from the King, from the mouths of others - drag after them.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: מְנָא אָמֵינָא לַהּ? דִּכְתִיב: ״לֹא תֹאבֶה לוֹ וְלֹא תִשְׁמַע אֵלָיו״. הָא אָבָה וְשָׁמַע – חַיָּיב.
human_translation: Abaye said: From where do I say As it is written: “You shall not approve of him, nor listen to him” approved and listened liable
llm_translation: Abbaye said: From where do I say this to her? As it is written: "You shall not desire him, and you shall not listen to him." If he desired and listened - he is liable.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי בְּנִיסָּת מִפִּי אֲחֵרִים, הָא דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ ״כָּךְ אוֹכֶלֶת״, ״כָּךְ שׁוֹתָה״, ״כָּךְ מְטִיבָה״, ״כָּךְ מְרֵיעָה״, הָא דְּלָא אֲמַר לֵיהּ ״כָּךְ אוֹכֶלֶת״, ״כָּךְ שׁוֹתָה״ כּוּ׳.
human_translation: Rava says: this and that to one incited by others, That where said to him: It eats like this; it drinks like this; it does good like this; it harms like this. This where did not say to him: It eats like this; it, drinks like this,
llm_translation: Rava said: Both this and that ruling are based on the testimony of others, as in the case where one said to her, "This is how you should eat," "This is how you should drink," "This is how you should recline," "This is how you should support yourself," as opposed to when he did not say to her, "This is how you should eat," "This is how you should drink," etc.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: מְנָא אָמֵינָא לַהּ? דִּכְתִיב: ״מֵאֱלֹהֵי הָעַמִּים אֲשֶׁר סְבִיבֹתֵיכֶם הַקְּרֹבִים אֵלֶיךָ וְגוֹ׳״. מָה לִי קְרוֹבִים וּמָה לִי רְחוֹקִים? הֲכִי קָאָמַר לָךְ: מִטִּיבוּתָן שֶׁל קְרוֹבִים אַתָּה לָמֵד מָה טִיבוּתָן שֶׁל רְחוֹקִים.
human_translation: Rava said: From where do I say As it is written: from the gods of the peoples that surround you, the ones near to you What to me near, and what to me far? this is saying to you: from the nature of near you can derive what the nature of far
llm_translation: Rava said: From where do I say this to her? As it is written: "From the gods of the nations that are around you, who are near to you, etc." What do I care about those who are near and what do I care about those who are far? This is what it is saying to you: You should learn from the goodness of those who are near, what is the goodness of those who are far.

hebrew_text: מַאי לָאו דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ: כָּךְ אוֹכֶלֶת, כָּךְ שׁוֹתֶה, כָּךְ מִטִּיבָהּ, כָּךְ מְרֵיעָה? שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: What, not where said to him: It eats like this; it drinks like this; it does good like this; it harms like this? Conclude from it
llm_translation: What is the reason that he did not say to her: "This is how you eat, this is how you drink, this is how you dress, this is how you adorn?" Learn from it.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: סֵיפָא בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל מְשׁוּמָּד.
human_translation: Rav Ashi says The latter clause to an apostate Jew;
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: The latter part concerning Yisrael is established.

hebrew_text: רָבִינָא אָמַר: לָא זוֹ אַף זוֹ קָתָנֵי.
human_translation: Ravina says teaches Not this also that.
llm_translation: Ravinah said: "Not this, also this, it is written."

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר: הָעוֹבֵד עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה מֵאַהֲבָה וּמִיִּרְאָה, אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: חַיָּיב, רָבָא אָמַר: פָּטוּר.
human_translation: It was stated one who worships idols due to love or due to fear Abaye says: liable. Rava says: exempt.
llm_translation: It was stated: One who performs idol worship out of love or fear, Abaye said: liable, Rava said: exempt.

hebrew_text: אַבָּיֵי אֲמַר: חַיָּיב, דְּהָא פַּלְחַהּ. רָבָא אָמַר: פָּטוּר, אִי קַבְּלַיהּ עֲלֵיהּ בֶּאֱלוֹהַּ – אִין, אִי לָא – לָא.
human_translation: Abaye says liable because he worshipped it. Rava says exempt, If accepted upon himself as a god, yes, if not not
llm_translation: Abaye said: obligated, because he plucked it. Rava said: exempt, if he accepted upon himself with a deity - yes, if not - no.

hebrew_text: סִימָן: עֶבֶד יִשְׁתַּחֲוֶה לְמָשִׁיחַ.
human_translation: mnemonic A slave will bow to the anointed.
llm_translation: Section: A slave shall bow down to the Messiah.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר אַבָּיֵי: מְנָא אָמֵינָא לַהּ? דִּתְנַן: הָעוֹבֵד עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה, אֶחָד הָעוֹבֵד כּוּ׳. מַאי לָאו אֶחָד הָעוֹבֵד מֵאַהֲבָה וּמִיִּרְאָה?
human_translation: And Abaye said: From where do I say As we learned One who worships idols one who worships What Is it not one who worships due to love or due to fear,
llm_translation: And Abaye said: From where do I say this to her? For it was taught: One who performs idol worship, one who performs like him. What is it that it is not one who performs out of love and fear?

hebrew_text: וְרָבָא אָמַר לָךְ: לָא, כְּדִמְתָרֵץ רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה.
human_translation: And Rava said to you not as Rabbi Yirmeya explains
llm_translation: And Rava said to you: No, as explained by Rabbi Yirmeya.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: מְנָא אָמֵינָא לַהּ? דְּתַנְיָא: ״לֹא תִשְׁתַּחֲוֶה לָהֶם״ – לָהֶם אִי אַתָּה מִשְׁתַּחֲוֶה, אֲבָל אַתָּה מִשְׁתַּחֲוֶה לְאָדָם כְּמוֹתְךָ. יָכוֹל אֲפִילּוּ נֶעֱבָד כְּהָמָן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְלֹא תָעׇבְדֵם״. וְהָא הָמָן מִיִּרְאָה הֲוָה נֶעֱבָד!
human_translation: Abaye said: From where do I say As it is taught “You shall not bow to them “To them,” you may not bow, but you may bow to a person like yourself; might even is worshipped like Haman; the verse states: “Nor worship them,” And wasn’t Haman worshipped due to fear,
llm_translation: Abaye said: From where do I say this to her? As it was taught: "You shall not bow down to them" - to them you shall not bow down, but you shall bow down to a person like yourself. Can one say even if he is worshipped like Haman? The verse teaches: "And you shall not serve them." But Haman, was he not worshipped!

hebrew_text: וְרָבָא: כְּהָמָן וְלֹא כְּהָמָן. כְּהָמָן – דְּאִיהוּ גּוּפֵיהּ עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה, וְלֹא כְּהָמָן – דְּאִילּוּ הָמָן מִיִּרְאָה, וְהָכָא לָאו מִיִּרְאָה.
human_translation: And Rava like Haman but not like Haman like Haman that himself was idol worship, But not like Haman as while Haman due to fear, and here not due to fear,
llm_translation: Rava said: Like Haman and not like Haman. Like Haman - for he himself engaged in idol worship, and not like Haman - for even if Haman were to be afraid, here there is no fear.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר אַבָּיֵי: מְנָא אָמֵינָא לַהּ? דְּתַנְיָא: כֹּהֵן מָשִׁיחַ בַּעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה, רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: בְּשִׁגְגַת מַעֲשֶׂה, וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: בְּהֶעְלֵם דָּבָר.
human_translation: And Abaye said: From where do I say As it is taught an anointed priest, in idol worship, Rabbi says: for unwitting act. And the Rabbis say: for a lapse of awareness
llm_translation: And Abaye said: From where do I say this? As it was taught: "The anointed priest in the service of idolatry," Rabbi says: in the case of unwitting performance, and the Sages say: in the case of concealing a matter.

hebrew_text: וְשָׁוִין, שֶׁבִּשְׂעִירָה כְּיָחִיד. וְשָׁוִין, שֶׁאֵין מֵבִיא אָשָׁם תָּלוּי.
human_translation: And they agree that a female goat as individual, And they agree that does not bring a provisional guilt-offering,
llm_translation: And they are equal, that in the goat as an individual. And they are equal, that one does not bring a guilt offering dependent.

hebrew_text: הַאי שִׁגְגַת מַעֲשֶׂה דַּעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה, הֵיכִי דָּמֵי? אִי קָסָבַר בֵּית הַכְּנֶסֶת הוּא וְהִשְׁתַּחֲוָה לוֹ, הֲרֵי לִבּוֹ לַשָּׁמַיִם! אֶלָּא דַּחֲזָא אִנְדְּרָטָא וְהִשְׁתַּחֲוָה לוֹ.
human_translation: What are the circumstances of unwitting act of idol worship If thought a synagogue and bowed to it, his heart toward Heaven, Rather, where saw statue and bowed to it.
llm_translation: This inadvertent act of foreign worship, what is its status? If he thought it was a synagogue and prostrated himself, his heart is directed towards heaven! Rather, if he saw an idol and prostrated himself.

hebrew_text: אִי קַבְּלֵיהּ עֲלֵיהּ בֶּאֱלוֹהַּ – מֵזִיד הוּא.
human_translation: If he accepted upon himself as a god, he is an intentional
llm_translation: If he accepted it upon himself with Eloah - it is intentional.

hebrew_text: וְאִי לָא קַבְּלֵיהּ עֲלֵיהּ בֶּאֱלוֹהַּ – לָא כְּלוּם הוּא. אֶלָּא לָאו, מֵאַהֲבָה וּמִיִּרְאָה?
human_translation: And if he did not accept upon himself as a god, is nothing. Rather, is not due to love or due to fear
llm_translation: If he does not accept it upon himself with the intent of serving God - it is nothing. Rather, is it not from love and awe?

hebrew_text: וְרָבָא אָמַר לָךְ: לָא, בְּאוֹמֵר מוּתָּר.
human_translation: And Rava said to you No, where says permitted.
llm_translation: And Rava said to you: No, by saying "mutar."

hebrew_text: אוֹמֵר מוּתָּר, הַיְינוּ הֶעְלֵם דָּבָר!
human_translation: says is permitted, this is a lapse of awareness
llm_translation: He says, "Mutar," that is, the concealment of a matter!

hebrew_text: בְּאוֹמֵר מוּתָּר לִגְמָרֵי. הֶעְלֵם דָּבָר – קִיּוּם מִקְצָת וּבִיטּוּל מִקְצָת.
human_translation: where he says entirely permitted, a lapse of awareness upholding part and negating part
llm_translation: He says: "Permitted entirely." Concealment of a matter - partial fulfillment and partial nullification.

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי רַבִּי זַכַּאי קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: זִיבַּח, וְקִיטֵּר, וְנִיסֵּךְ, וְהִשְׁתַּחֲוָה בְּהֶעְלֵם אֶחָד – אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב אֶלָּא אַחַת.
human_translation: Rabbi Zakkai taught before Rabbi Yoḥanan: sacrificed and burned and poured a libation and bowed in one lapse of awareness, he is obligated only one
llm_translation: It was taught by Rabbi Zakkai before Rabbi Yochanan: He slaughtered, and he burned incense, and he poured a libation, and he prostrated himself in one concealment - he is liable only once.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: פּוֹק תְּנִי לְבָרָא.
human_translation: said to him: Go out teach outside;
llm_translation: He said to him: Go, teach to the son of Bara.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא: הָא דְּאָמַר רַבִּי זַכַּאי מַחְלוֹקֶת רַבִּי יוֹסֵי וְרַבִּי נָתָן, דְּתַנְיָא: הַבְעָרָה לְלָאו יָצָאת, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי.
human_translation: Rabbi Abba says: That which Rabbi Zakkai says dispute Rabbi Yosei and Rabbi Natan, as it is taught kindling was singled out to prohibition, the statement of Rabbi Yosei.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Abba: This that Rabbi Zakkai said, the dispute of Rabbi Yosei and Rabbi Natan, as it was taught: A burning without intent does not fulfill the obligation, the words of Rabbi Yosei.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי נָתָן אוֹמֵר: לְחַלֵּק יָצָאת.
human_translation: And Rabbi Natan says: it was singled out to divide
llm_translation: And Rabbi Natan says: "To divide you shall go out."

hebrew_text: לְמַאן דְּאָמַר הַבְעָרָה לְלָאו יָצָאת, הִשְׁתַּחֲוָאָה נָמֵי לְלָאו יָצָאת.
human_translation: According to the one who says kindling was singled out to prohibition, bowing, was also singled out to prohibition,
llm_translation: To whom that said burning is not considered a valid act of extinguishing, bowing down is also not considered a valid act of extinguishing.

hebrew_text: לְמַאן דְּאָמַר הַבְעָרָה לְחַלֵּק יָצָאת, הִשְׁתַּחֲוָאָה נָמֵי לְחַלֵּק יָצָאת.
human_translation: according to the one who says kindling was singled out to divide bowing was also singled out to divide
llm_translation: To whom that said burning to divide is considered as having fulfilled the obligation, prostration also to divide is considered as having fulfilled the obligation.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב יוֹסֵף: דִּילְמָא עַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הָתָם הַבְעָרָה לְלָאו יָצָאת, דְּנָפְקָא לֵיהּ חִילּוּק מְלָאכוֹת מֵ״אַחַת מֵהֵנָּה״?
human_translation: Rav Yosef objects to this: Perhaps Rabbi Yosei says there, kindling was singled out to prohibition only because he derives the division of labors from “From one of them”
llm_translation: Rav Yosef objects to him: Perhaps until here Rabbi Yosei did not say, there the burning for its own sake you have not fulfilled, for it emerges to him the division of labors from one of them?

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר, ״וְעָשָׂה מֵאַחַת מֵהֵנָּה״ – פְּעָמִים שֶׁחַיָּיב אַחַת עַל כּוּלָּן, פְּעָמִים שֶׁחַיָּיב עַל כׇּל אַחַת וְאַחַת.
human_translation: As it is taught Rabbi Yosei says and performs from one of them” times when liable one for all and times when liable for each and every
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi Yosei says, "And he shall make from one of them" - sometimes one is obligated for all of them, sometimes one is obligated for each and every one.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי? דִּכְתִיב ״וְעָשָׂה מֵאַחַת מֵהֵנָּה״. ״אַחַת״, ״מֵאַחַת״. ״הֵנָּה״, ״מֵהֵנָּה״. אַחַת שֶׁהִיא הֵנָּה, וְהֵנָּה שֶׁהִיא אַחַת.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yonatan says: What is the reason of Rabbi Yosei? As it is written: “And performs from one of them,” “one” “From one.” “them” “Of them.” one that, is them, And them, that, are one.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yonatan said: What is the reason of Rabbi Yosei? For it is written, "and he shall make from one of them." "One," "from one." "Them," "from them." One that is them, and them that is one.

human_translation: “One” Shimon. “from one” shin mem , from Shimon.
llm_translation: "One" - "Shimon," "from one" - "Shem" from "Shimon."

hebrew_text: ״הֵנָּה״ – אָבוֹת, ״מֵהֵנָּה״ – תּוֹלָדוֹת. ״אַחַת״ שֶׁהִיא ״הֵנָּה״: זְדוֹן שַׁבָּת וְשִׁגְגַת מְלָאכוֹת. ״הֵנָּה״ שֶׁהִיא ״אַחַת״: שִׁגְגַת שַׁבָּת וּזְדוֹן מְלָאכוֹת.
human_translation: “Them” primary categories “of them” subcategories one that is them, intention, Shabbat and unawareness acts of labor them, that are one unawareness Shabbat and intention, acts of labor
llm_translation: "Behold" - Avot, "from behold" - Toldot. "One" which is "behold": intentional violation of Shabbat and unintentional violations of labor. "Behold" which is "one": unintentional violation of Shabbat and intentional violations of labor.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל הָכָא, דְּלָא נָפְקָא לֵיהּ חִילּוּק מְלָאכוֹת מִדּוּכְתָּא אַחֲרִיתִי, דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא הִשְׁתַּחֲוָאָה לְחַלֵּק יָצָאת.
human_translation: But here, where he does not derive the division of labors, from another place, everyone that bowing was singled out to divide
llm_translation: However, here, since the division of labor did not emerge from the last furnace, the entire world has bowed down to divide the output.

hebrew_text: חִילּוּק מְלָאכוֹת דַּעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה נָמֵי תִּיפּוֹק לֵיהּ מֵ״אַחַת מֵהֵנָּה״? ״אַחַת״ – זְבִיחָה, ״מֵאַחַת״ – סִימָן אֶחָד.
human_translation: derive the division of labors with regard to idol worship, too, from one of them”? “one” sacrificing “from one” one of the organs,
llm_translation: Division of the labors of the foreign service, is it derived from "one of these"? "One" - slaughter, "from one" - a single sign.

hebrew_text: ״הֵנָּה״ – אָבוֹת: זִיבּוּחַ, קִיטּוּר, נִיסּוּךְ, וְהִשְׁתַּחֲוָאָה. ״מֵהֵנָּה״ – תּוֹלָדוֹת: שָׁבַר מַקֵּל לְפָנֶיהָ.
human_translation: “them” primary categories sacrificing burning pouring and bowing. “of them” subcategories broke a stick before
llm_translation: "Behold" - Avot: slaughter, incense, libation, and prostration. "From behold" - Toldot: he broke the staff before her.

hebrew_text: ״אַחַת״ שֶׁהִיא ״הֵנָּה״: זְדוֹן עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה וְשִׁגְגַת עֲבוֹדוֹת. ״הֵנָּה״ שֶׁהִיא ״אַחַת״: שִׁגְגַת עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה וּזְדוֹן עֲבוֹדוֹת.
human_translation: one that is them, intention, idol worship and unawareness rites them, that are one unawareness idol worship, and intention, rites
llm_translation: "One" which is "here": intentional idolatry and unintentional idolatry. "Here" which is "one": unintentional idolatry of intentional idolatry and intentional idolatry of unintentional idolatry.

hebrew_text: הַאי שִׁגְגַת עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה, הֵיכִי דָּמֵי? אִי קָסָבַר בֵּית הַכְּנֶסֶת הוּא וְהִשְׁתַּחֲוָה לוֹ, הֲרֵי לִבּוֹ לַשָּׁמַיִם.
human_translation: What are the circumstances unawareness idol worship? If thought a synagogue and bowed to it, his heart toward Heaven.
llm_translation: This inadvertent transgression of foreign worship, what is its status? If he thought it was a synagogue and prostrated himself, his heart is directed towards Heaven.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא דַּחֲזָא אִנְדְּרָטָא וּסְגֵיד לֵיהּ. אִי קַבְּלֵיהּ עֲלֵיהּ – מֵזִיד הוּא, אִי לָא קַבְּלֵיהּ עֲלֵיהּ – לָא כְּלוּם הוּא.
human_translation: Rather, where saw a statue [ andarta ] and bowed to it. If he accepted upon himself he is an intentional If he did not accept him upon himself is nothing.
llm_translation: Rather, he saw an Indarta and worshiped it. If he accepted it upon himself - it is intentional, if he did not accept it upon himself - it is nothing.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מֵאַהֲבָה וּמִיִּרְאָה. הָנִיחָא לְאַבַּיֵּי, דְּאָמַר חַיָּיב; אֶלָּא לְרָבָא, דְּאָמַר פָּטוּר, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר?
human_translation: Rather, due to love or due to fear This works out well according to Abaye, who says liable; But according to Rava, who says exempt, what can be said?
llm_translation: Rather, from love and fear. Leave it to Abbaye, who said obligated; rather to Rava, who said exempt, what is there to say?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא בְּאוֹמֵר ״מוּתָּר״. תִּפְשׁוֹט דִּבְעָא מִינֵּיהּ רָבָא מֵרַב נַחְמָן: הֶעְלֵם זֶה וָזֶה בְּיָדוֹ, מַהוּ?
human_translation: Rather, where says permitted resolve the dilemma that Rava raised before Rav Naḥman: What is has a lapse of awareness of this, and that,
llm_translation: Rather, in the case where it says "permitted." Should we interpret that Rav Nahman sought to conceal both this and that in his hand, what is the ruling?

hebrew_text: תִּיפְשׁוֹט, דְּאֵינוֹ חַיָּיב אֶלָּא אַחַת. הָא לָא קַשְׁיָא, וְתִפְשׁוֹט.
human_translation: resolve that is obligated only one This not difficult; resolve
llm_translation: The text reads: "Tifshot, de'eino chayav ela achat. Ha la kashya, ve'tifshot."

hebrew_text: וּמִי מָצֵית מוֹקְמַתְּ לְהָנֵי קְרָאֵי בַּעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה? דְּאִילּוּ הָכָא, כְּתִיב: בְּמָשִׁיחַ – פַּר, וּבְנָשִׂיא – שָׂעִיר, וּבְיָחִיד – כִּשְׂבָּה וּשְׂעִירָה.
human_translation: But can you interpret these verses, with regard to idol worship As here, it is written with regard to an anointed priest, a bull and with regard to a king a goat and with regard to individual a female lamb or a female goat.
llm_translation: And who established the order for the sacrifices in the Temple service? For if it were here, it is written: "For the anointed one - a bull, and for the prince - a he-goat, and for an individual - a female goat and a male goat."

hebrew_text: וְאִילּוּ בַּעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה תְּנַן: וְשָׁוִין שֶׁבִּשְׂעִירָה כְּיָחִיד.
human_translation: Whereas with regard to idol worship we learned And they agree that a female goat as individual.
llm_translation: And if in idol worship we learned: "And equal are those in the goat as an individual."

hebrew_text: וְתוּ לָא מִידֵּי.
human_translation: And nothing more
llm_translation: And come not from his hand.

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא רַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר יְהוּדָה, אָמַר:
human_translation: When Rav Shmuel bar Yehuda came said:
llm_translation: When Rav Shmuel, son of Yehuda, came, he said:

hebrew_text: הָכִי תְּנָא קַמֵּיהּ: חוֹמֶר בַּשַּׁבָּת מִשְּׁאָר מִצְוֹת, חוֹמֶר בִּשְׁאָר מִצְוֹת מִבַּשַּׁבָּת. חוֹמֶר בַּשַּׁבָּת – שֶׁהַשַּׁבָּת עָשָׂה שְׁתַּיִם בְּהֶעְלֵם אֶחָד, חַיָּיב עַל כׇּל אַחַת וְאַחַת, מַה שֶּׁאֵין כֵּן בִּשְׁאָר מִצְוֹת. חוֹמֶר בִּשְׁאָר מִצְוֹת – שֶׁבִּשְׁאָר מִצְוֹת שָׁגַג בְּלֹא מִתְכַּוֵּין חַיָּיב, מַה שֶּׁאֵין כֵּן בַּשַּׁבָּת.
human_translation: This taught before a stringency with regard to Shabbat vis-à-vis other mitzvot, a stringency with regard to other mitzvot vis-à-vis Shabbat. a stringency with regard to Shabbat, as Shabbat, performed two in one lapse of awareness, obligated for each and every which is not so with regard to other mitzvot. a stringency with regard to other mitzvot, as with regard to other mitzvot, unwittingly, without intent obligated which is not so with regard to Shabbat.
llm_translation: So did the Tanna teach before him: A stringency in Shabbat over other commandments, a stringency in other commandments over Shabbat. A stringency in Shabbat - that Shabbat, one is liable for each and every hidden act, which is not the case with other commandments. A stringency in other commandments - that for other commandments, if one unintentionally transgresses, he is liable, which is not the case with Shabbat.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: חוֹמֶר בַּשַּׁבָּת, שֶׁהַשַּׁבָּת עָשָׂה שְׁתַּיִם כּוּ׳. הֵיכִי דָּמֵי? אִילֵּימָא דַּעֲבַד קְצִירָה וּטְחִינָה, דִּכְוָותַהּ גַּבֵּי שְׁאָר מִצְוֹת – דַּאֲכַל חֵלֶב וָדָם. הָכָא תַּרְתֵּי מִיחַיַּיב, וְהָכָא תַּרְתֵּי מִיחַיַּיב!
human_translation: The Master said: a stringency with regard to Shabbat, as Shabbat, performed two What are the circumstances? If we say that performed reaping and grinding the corresponding with regard to other mitzvot where consumed fat and blood. here, is obligated two and there, is obligated two
llm_translation: Master said: Stringency in Shabbat, for Shabbat made two. How so? If you say for doing reaping and grinding, which its violation is like other commandments - for eating forbidden fats and blood. Here, two are liable, and here, two are liable!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, גַּבֵּי שְׁאָר מִצְוֹת דְּאֵינוֹ חַיָּיב אֶלָּא אַחַת, הֵיכִי דָּמֵי? דַּאֲכַל חֵלֶב וָחֵלֶב. דִּכְוָותַהּ גַּבֵּי שַׁבָּת, דַּעֲבַד קְצִירָה וּקְצִירָה. הָכָא חֲדָא מִיחַיַּיב, וְהָכָא חֲדָא מִיחַיַּיב.
human_translation: Rather, what are the circumstances with regard to other mitzvot where obligated only one where he consumed fat and fat The corresponding with regard to Shabbat where performed reaping and reaping here, is obligated one and there, is obligated one
llm_translation: Rather, regarding other mitzvot for which one is only liable for one transgression, how so? For example, eating forbidden fats. This is comparable to Shabbat, where one performs two separate harvestings. Here, one is liable for one, and here, one is liable for one.

hebrew_text: וְהַיְינוּ דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ: ״פּוֹק תְּנִי לְבָרָא!״
human_translation: And that is that said to Go out teach outside;
llm_translation: And this is what he said to him: "Go, teach your son!"

hebrew_text: מַאי קוּשְׁיָא? דִּילְמָא לְעוֹלָם אֵימָא לְךָ דַּעֲבַד קְצִירָה וּטְחִינָה, ״מַה שֶּׁאֵין כֵּן בִּשְׁאָר מִצְוֹת״ אֲתָאן לַעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה כִּדְרַבִּי אַמֵּי, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אַמֵּי: זִיבַּח וְקִיטֵּר וְנִיסֵּךְ בְּהֶעְלֵם אֶחָד – אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב אֶלָּא אַחַת.
human_translation: What is the difficulty Actually, perhaps I will say to you where performed reaping and grinding Which is not so with regard to other mitzvot, we arrive at idol worship, in accordance with of Rabbi Ami. As Rabbi Ami says: sacrificed and burned and poured a libation, in one lapse of awareness, he is obligated to only one
llm_translation: What is the question? Perhaps I will say to you that one who performs reaping and grinding, "that which is not so with other commandments," comes to foreign worship like Rabbi Ammi, for Rabbi Ammi said: One who slaughters, offers incense, and pours a libation in one concealment - he is liable only once.

hebrew_text: לָא מִיתּוֹקְמָא לֵיהּ בַּעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה, דְּקָתָנֵי סֵיפָא: חוֹמֶר בִּשְׁאָר מִצְוֹת, שֶׁבִּשְׁאָר מִצְוֹת שָׁגַג בְּלֹא מִתְכַּוֵּין – חַיָּיב.
human_translation: cannot be interpreted to idol worship, as it teaches in the last clause: a stringency with regard to other mitzvot, as with regard to other mitzvot, unwittingly, without intent obligated
llm_translation: He did not incur liability for it in the case of foreign worship, as the latter clause teaches: The stringency in other commandments, that in other commandments one is liable for unintentional transgression without intent.

hebrew_text: שׁוֹגֵג בְּלֹא מִתְכַּוֵּין בַּעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה, הֵיכִי דָּמֵי? אִי דְּקָסָבַר בֵּית הַכְּנֶסֶת הוּא וְהִשְׁתַּחֲוָה לוֹ, הֲרֵי לִבּוֹ לַשָּׁמַיִם. אֶלָּא דַּחֲזָא אִנְדְּרָטָא וּסְגֵיד לֵיהּ. אִי קַבְּלֵיהּ עֲלֵיהּ בֶּאֱלוֹהַּ – מֵזִיד הוּא, וְאִי לָא קַבְּלֵיהּ עֲלֵיהּ – לֹא כְּלוּם הִיא.
human_translation: What are the circumstances unwittingly idol worship without intent If he thought a synagogue and bowed to it, his heart was toward Heaven. Rather, where saw statue and bowed to it. If he accepted upon himself as a god, he is an intentional And if he did not accept him upon himself is nothing.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: A mistaken act without intention in idol worship, what is the law? If he thought it was a synagogue and prostrated himself, his heart is directed towards Heaven. Rather, if he saw an idol and bowed to it. If he accepts it upon himself as a god - it is intentional, and if he does not accept it upon himself - it is nothing.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מֵאַהֲבָה וּמִיִּרְאָה. הָנִיחָא לְאַבַּיֵּי, דְּאָמַר חַיָּיב. אֶלָּא לְרָבָא, דְּאָמַר פָּטוּר, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר?
human_translation: Rather, due to love or due to fear This works out well according to Abaye, who says liable; But according to Rava, who says exempt, what can be said?
llm_translation: Rather from love and from fear. Leave it to Abbaye, for he said obligated. Rather to Rava, for he said exempt. What is there to say?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא בְּאוֹמֵר מוּתָּר, מַה שֶּׁאֵין כֵּן בַּשַּׁבָּת דְּפָטוּר לִגְמָרֵי.
human_translation: Rather, where says permitted Which is not so in Shabbat, who is completely exempt,
llm_translation: Rather, in the case of "permitted," that which is not so on Shabbat is completely exempt.

hebrew_text: עַד כָּאן לָא בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ רָבָא מֵרַב נַחְמָן הֶעְלֵם זֶה וָזֶה – אֶלָּא אִי לְחַיּוֹבֵי חֲדָא, אִי לְחַיּוֹבֵי תַּרְתֵּי. פָּטוּר לִגְמָרֵי – לֵיכָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר.
human_translation: Rava asked Rav Naḥman a lapse of awareness of this, and that only whether to deem obligated one whether to deem obligated two There is no one who says entirely exempt,
llm_translation: Until here, Rava did not ask from Rav Nachman about this concealment - rather, whether for the liability of one, or for the liability of two. He is completely exempt - there is no support for the one who says.

hebrew_text: מַאי קוּשְׁיָא? דִּלְמָא לְעוֹלָם אֵימָא לָךְ: רֵישָׁא בַּעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה, וְסֵיפָא בִּשְׁאָר מִצְוֹת.
human_translation: What is the difficulty Actually, perhaps I will say to you the first clause to idol worship, and the last clause to other mitzvot.
llm_translation: What is the question? Perhaps I will say to you: the beginning regarding idol worship, and the end regarding other commandments.

hebrew_text: וְשָׁגַג בְּלֹא מִתְכַּוֵּין, דְּקָסָבַר רוֹק הוּא וּבְלָעוֹ. מַה שֶׁאֵין כֵּן בַּשַּׁבָּת, דְּפָטוּר. שֶׁנִּתְכַּוֵּין לְהַגְבִּיהַּ אֶת הַתָּלוּשׁ וְחָתַךְ אֶת הַמְחוּבָּר – פָּטוּר.
human_translation: And unwittingly, without intent where thinks it is spittle, and he swallows it. which is not so with regard to Shabbat, where exempt. As, intended to lift detached and severed attached exempt.
llm_translation: "And one who erred without intent, for he thought it was saliva and swallowed it. That which is not so on Shabbat, for he is exempt. If one intended to lift the hanging object and cut the attached object - he is exempt."

hebrew_text: וְכִדְרַב נַחְמָן אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל, דְּאָמַר: הַמִּתְעַסֵּק בַּחֲלָבִים וּבַעֲרָיוֹת – חַיָּיב, שֶׁכֵּן נֶהֱנֶה; הַמִּתְעַסֵּק בְּשַׁבָּת – פָּטוּר, מְלֶאכֶת מַחְשֶׁבֶת אָסְרָה תּוֹרָה.
human_translation: And in accordance with that Rav Naḥman Shmuel says, as he says: One who acts unawares with fats or with those with whom sexual relations are forbidden, obligated since he derived pleasure one who acts unawares on Shabbat, exempt, the Torah prohibits planned labor.
llm_translation: As Rav Nachman said in the name of Shmuel, who said: One who engages in forbidden sexual relationships and in forbidden fats - is liable, for he derives benefit; one who engages in Shabbat - is exempt, for the Torah prohibited only purposeful work.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן לְטַעְמֵיהּ, דְּלָא מוֹקֵים מַתְנִיתָא רֵישָׁא בְּחַד טַעְמָא וְסֵיפָא בְּחַד טַעְמָא.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan to his reasoning, that he does not interpret the first clause a baraita with one explanation and the last clause with one explanation.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan according to his reasoning, that we do not establish the beginning of the Mishnah with one reason and the end with another reason.

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מַאן דִּמְתַרְגֵּם לִי חָבִית אַלִּיבָּא דְּחַד תַּנָּא, מוֹבֵילְנָא מָאנֵיהּ בָּתְרֵיהּ לְבֵי מַסּוּתָא.
human_translation: As Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Whoever explains to me a barrel in accordance with of one tanna , I will carry his clothes after him to the bathhouse,
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: Rabbi Yochanan said: Whoever translates for me a barrel of wine in the house of a certain teacher, I will bring him two to the winepress.

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא,
human_translation: the itself,
llm_translation: The body.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אַמֵּי: זִיבַּח וְקִיטֵּר וְנִיסֵּךְ בְּהֶעְלֵם אֶחָד, אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב אֶלָּא אַחַת. אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי אַמֵּי? אָמַר קְרָא ״לֹא תָעׇבְדֵם״, הַכָּתוּב עֲשָׂאָן כּוּלָּן עֲבוֹדָה אַחַת.
human_translation: Rabbi Ami says: sacrificed and burned and poured a libation, in one lapse of awareness, he is obligated only one Abaye says: What is the reason for Rabbi Ami? The verse states: “Nor worship them” The verse renders all one rite.
llm_translation: Rabbi Ammi said: One who slaughters, offers incense, and pours a libation in one concealment, is liable only for one. Abaye said: What is the reason for Rabbi Ammi's statement? The verse states, "You shall not serve them," indicating that the Torah made them all one service.

hebrew_text: וּמִי אָמַר אַבָּיֵי הָכִי? וְהָאָמַר אַבָּיֵי: שָׁלֹשׁ הִשְׁתַּחֲוָאוֹת בַּעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה לָמָּה?
human_translation: And does Abaye say this? But doesn’t Abaye say: Why three bowing to idol worship?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Umi amar Abbayei hachi? Veha'amar Abbayei: Shalosh hishtachavayot ba'avodah zarah lama?" English translation: "And who said so, Abbayei, like this? And Abbayei said: Three prostrations in foreign worship, why?"

hebrew_text: אַחַת לִכְדַרְכָּהּ, וְאַחַת שֶׁלֹּא כְּדַרְכָּהּ, וְאַחַת לְחַלֵּק.
human_translation: one for its manner and one not its manner and one to divide
llm_translation: One according to its way, and one not according to its way, and one to divide.

hebrew_text: לִדְבָרָיו דְּרַבִּי אַמֵּי קָאָמַר, וְלֵיהּ לָא סְבִירָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: stated in accordance with the statement of Rabbi Ami, but himself does not hold accordingly.
llm_translation: According to the words of Rabbi Ammi, and to him it does not seem.

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא, אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: שָׁלֹשׁ הִשְׁתַּחֲוָאוֹת בַּעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה לָמָּה? אַחַת לִכְדַרְכָּהּ, וְאַחַת שֶׁלֹּא כְּדַרְכָּהּ, וְאַחַת לְחַלֵּק.
human_translation: the itself Abaye says: Why three bowing to idol worship? One for its manner and one not its manner and one to divide
llm_translation: The body, Abaye said: Three prostrations in idol worship, why? One according to its way, and one not according to its way, and one to divide.

hebrew_text: לִכְדַרְכָּהּ, מֵ״אֵיכָה יַעַבְדוּ הַגּוֹיִם הָאֵלֶּה״ נָפְקָא.
human_translation: for its manner is derived from how do these nations serve
llm_translation: According to its way, "How can these nations serve?" is derived.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, אַחַת כְּדַרְכָּהּ וְשֶׁלֹּא כְּדַרְכָּהּ, וְאַחַת לְשֶׁלֹּא כְּדַרְכָּהּ, וְאַחַת לְחַלֵּק.
human_translation: Rather, One for its manner but not its manner And one not its manner And one to divide
llm_translation: Rather, one as it is accustomed and one not as it is accustomed, and one for not as it is accustomed, and one to divide.

hebrew_text: הַמְקַבְּלוֹ עָלָיו בֶּאֱלוֹהַּ, הָאוֹמֵר לוֹ ״אֵלִי אַתָּה״. אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ אָמַר רַב: כֵּיוָן שֶׁאָמַר לוֹ ״אֵלִי אַתָּה״ – חַיָּיב.
human_translation: one who accepts upon himself as a god one who says to You are my god. Rav Naḥman says Rabba bar Avuh says Rav says: Once said to You are my god, liable
llm_translation: The one who accepts upon himself the obligation with an oath by God, who says to him "You are my God." Rav Nachman said in the name of Rabba bar Avuh said Rav: Once he says to him "You are my God" - he is obligated.

hebrew_text: לְמַאי? אִי לִקְטָלָא, מַתְנִיתִין הִיא! אֶלָּא לְקׇרְבָּן.
human_translation: to what If to death is the mishna. Rather, to an offering.
llm_translation: For what? If for gathering, it is a Mishnah! Rather, for a sacrifice.

hebrew_text: וַאֲפִילּוּ לְרַבָּנַן? וְהָתַנְיָא: אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב אֶלָּא עַל דָּבָר שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ מַעֲשֶׂה, כְּגוֹן זִיבּוּחַ וְקִיטּוּר וְנִיסּוּךְ וְהִשְׁתַּחֲוָאָה. וְאָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: מַאן תְּנָא הִשְׁתַּחֲוָאָה? רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא הִיא, דְּאָמַר לָא בָּעֵינַן מַעֲשֶׂה. מִכְּלָל דְּרַבָּנַן סָבְרִי בָּעֵינַן מַעֲשֶׂה.
human_translation: And even according to the Rabbis? But isn’t it taught is obligated only for a matter, that involves an action, e.g., sacrificing or burning or pouring or bowing? And Reish Lakish says: Who taught bowing It is Rabbi Akiva, who says we do not require action By inference, the Rabbis, maintain we require action.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Even for the Rabbis? And it was taught: One is liable only for something that involves an action, such as slaughtering, offering incense, pouring libations, and prostration. And Reish Lakish said: Who is the Tanna who holds that prostration does not require an action? It is Rabbi Akiva, for he said we do not require an action. From the general principle, the Rabbis hold that we require an action.

hebrew_text: כִּי קָאָמַר רַב נָמֵי, לְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא קָאָמַר.
human_translation: Rav, too, when he states he states according to Rabbi Akiva.
llm_translation: For Rav Namei said, he said to Rabbi Akiva.

hebrew_text: לְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, פְּשִׁיטָא! הַיְינוּ מְגַדֵּף.
human_translation: according to Rabbi Akiva, obvious This is a blasphemer,
llm_translation: To Rabbi Akiva, obvious! That is a blasphemer.

hebrew_text: מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: עַד כָּאן לָא מְחַיֵּיב רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא קׇרְבָּן אֶלָּא בִּמְגַדֵּף, דִּכְתִיב בֵּיהּ כָּרֵת. אֲבָל הָכָא, דְּלָא כְּתִיב בֵּיהּ כָּרֵת, אֵימָא לָא.
human_translation: lest you say Rabbi Akiva obligates an offering only in a blasphemer, as it is written with regard to karet But here, where karet is not written say not
llm_translation: What is the reasoning? Until here, Rabbi Akiva does not obligate a sacrifice except for one who blasphemes, as it is written in it "cut off." But here, where it is not written in it "cut off," say no.

hebrew_text: קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דְּאִתַּקּוֹשֵׁי אִתַּקּוּשׁ, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיִּשְׁתַּחֲווּ לוֹ וַיִּזְבְּחוּ לוֹ וַיֹּאמְרוּ וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: teaches us that compares as it is written: and have bowed to it, and have sacrificed to it, and said:
llm_translation: They were inquiring of us, that they were inquiring, as it is written: "And they bowed down to him and sacrificed to him and said, etc."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אִלְמָלֵא וָיו שֶׁבְּ״הֶעֱלוּךָ״, נִתְחַיְּיבוּ שׂוֹנְאֵיהֶם שֶׁל יִשְׂרָאֵל כְּלָיָיה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Were it not for the vav in “Which brought you up [ he’elukha ],” the haters of the Jewish people, would have been sentenced to destruction
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: If not for the verse in the Torah that says, "He will cause you to be lifted up," the enemies of the Jewish people would have been destroyed.

hebrew_text: כְּתַנָּאֵי: אֲחֵרִים אוֹמְרִים, אִלְמָלֵא וָיו שֶׁבְּ״הֶעֱלוּךָ״, נִתְחַיְּיבוּ שׂוֹנְאֵיהֶם שֶׁל יִשְׂרָאֵל כְּלָיָיה.
human_translation: like tanna’im : Others say: Were it not for the vav in “Which brought you up [ he’elukha ],” the haters of the Jewish people would have been sentenced to destruction.
llm_translation: The Tannaim: Others say, if not for the "vav" in "He elevated you," the enemies of the Israelites would have been destroyed.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַאי: וַהֲלֹא כׇּל הַמְשַׁתֵּף שֵׁם שָׁמַיִם וְדָבָר אַחֵר נֶעֱקָר מִן הָעוֹלָם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״בִּלְתִּי לַה׳ לְבַדּוֹ״! אֶלָּא מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״אֲשֶׁר הֶעֱלוּךָ״? שֶׁאִיוּוּ אֱלוֹהוֹת הַרְבֵּה.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai said to him: But isn’t anyone who links the name of Heaven and something else, uprooted from the world? As it is stated: save to the Lord only, Rather, what the verse states: “Which brought you up” that desired many gods;
llm_translation: He said to him Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai: But isn't it that anyone who associates the Name of Heaven with something else is uprooted from the world, as it says, "Except for the Lord alone"! Rather, what does the verse mean by saying, "that have brought you up"? That there are not many gods.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל הַמְגַפֵּף וְהַמְנַשֵּׁק, הַמְכַבֵּד וְהַמְרַבֵּץ כּוּ׳. כִּי אֲתָא רַב דִּימִי, אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: עַל כּוּלָּם לוֹקֶה, חוּץ מֵהַנּוֹדֵר בִּשְׁמוֹ וְהַמְקַיֵּים בִּשְׁמוֹ.
human_translation: But one who hugs or one who kisses or one who cleans or one who sprays When Rav Dimi came Rabbi Elazar says: For all of is flogged, with the exception of one who vows in name and one who affirms in its name.
llm_translation: The one who claps and the one who kisses, the one who honors and the one who disgraces, etc. When Rav Dimi came, Rabbi Elazar said: All of them are liable, except for one who vows in the name of his god and one who fulfills in the name of his god.

hebrew_text: מַאי שְׁנָא הַנּוֹדֵר בִּשְׁמוֹ וְהַמְקַיֵּים בִּשְׁמוֹ דְּלָא לָקֵי? מִשּׁוּם דְּהָוֵה לֵיהּ לָאו שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ מַעֲשֶׂה. הָנֵי נָמֵי לָאו שֶׁבִּכְלָלוֹת הוּא, וְאֵין לוֹקִין עַל לָאו שֶׁבִּכְלָלוֹת.
human_translation: What is different one who vows in name and one who affirms in its name, that are not flogged? because they are a prohibition that does not involve an action. These too, a general prohibition, and one is not flogged for a general prohibition,
llm_translation: What is the difference between one who vows in the name of God and one who fulfills in the name of God, that he is not punished? Because it is not a matter of action. These cases are also not included in the general prohibition, and one is not punished for a prohibition that is not included in the general prohibition.

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: מִנַּיִן לְאוֹכֵל מִן הַבְּהֵמָה קוֹדֶם שֶׁתֵּצֵא נַפְשָׁהּ שֶׁהוּא בְּלֹא תַעֲשֶׂה? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״לֹא תֹאכְלוּ עַל הַדָּם״.
human_translation: As is taught From where that one who eats from an animal before its soul departs is of a prohibition? The verse states: “You shall not eat with the blood”
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: From where do we derive that one may eat from an animal before its life departs, which is a prohibition by omission? The verse teaches: "You shall not eat upon the blood" (Leviticus 19:26).

hebrew_text: דָּבָר אַחֵר: ״לֹא תֹאכְלוּ עַל הַדָּם״ – לֹא תֹּאכְלוּ בָּשָׂר, וַעֲדַיִן דָּם בְּמִזְרָק.
human_translation: Another matter “You shall not eat with the blood”: You shall not eat meat while blood is still in the bowl,
llm_translation: Another matter: "Do not eat upon the blood" - do not eat flesh, and yet there is still blood in the vessel.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי דּוֹסָא אוֹמֵר: מִנַּיִין שֶׁאֵין מַבְרִין עַל הֲרוּגֵי בֵּית דִּין? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״לֹא תֹאכְלוּ עַל הַדָּם״.
human_translation: Rabbi Dosa says: From where that do not provide with a meal of those executed by the court? The verse states: “You shall not eat with the blood,”
llm_translation: Rabbi Dosa says: From where do we derive that we do not eat upon the slain of the court? The Torah teaches: "Do not eat upon the blood."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: מִנַּיִן לְסַנְהֶדְרִין שֶׁהָרְגוּ אֶת הַנֶּפֶשׁ, שֶׁאֵין טוֹעֲמִין כְּלוּם כׇּל אוֹתוֹ הַיּוֹם? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״לֹא תֹאכְלוּ עַל הַדָּם״.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: From where to a Sanhedrin that killed a soul, that may not taste anything that entire day The verse states: “You shall not eat with the blood.”
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: From where do we derive for the Sanhedrin that executed a soul, that they do not taste anything the entire day? The Torah teaches: "Do not eat upon the blood."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אַזְהָרָה לְבֵן סוֹרֵר וּמוֹרֶה מִנַּיִן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״לֹא תֹאכְלוּ עַל הַדָּם״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: From where is prohibition against a stubborn and rebellious son The verse states: “You shall not eat with the blood,”
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yochanan: From where is the warning for a wayward and rebellious son derived? Scripture teaches: "Do not eat upon the blood."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי אָבִין בַּר חִיָּיא, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַבִּי אָבִין בַּר כָּהֲנָא: עַל כּוּלָּם אֵינוֹ לוֹקֶה, מִשּׁוּם דְּהָוֵה לֵיהּ לָאו שֶׁבִּכְלָלוֹת.
human_translation: And Rabbi Avin bar Ḥiyya says, and some say Rabbi Avin bar Kahana For all of is not flogged as it is a general prohibition
llm_translation: And Rabbi Avin bar Chiya said, and some say Rabbi Avin bar Kohana: On all of them he is not liable, because it is not included in his domain.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, כִּי אֲתָא רָבִין אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: עַל כּוּלָּן אֵינוֹ לוֹקֶה, חוּץ מִן הַנּוֹדֵר בִּשְׁמוֹ וְהַמְקַיֵּים בִּשְׁמוֹ.
human_translation: Rather, when Ravin came Rabbi Elazar says: For all of is not flogged, with the exception of one who vows in name and one who affirms in its name.
llm_translation: Rather, when Ravin came, Rabbi Elazar said: On all of them he is not liable, except for one who vows in the name of his god and fulfills in the name of his god.

hebrew_text: מַאי שְׁנָא אַהָנָךְ דְּלָא לָקֵי? דְּהָוֵה לֵיהּ לָאו שֶׁבִּכְלָלוֹת. הָנֵי נָמֵי לָאו שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ מַעֲשֶׂה נִינְהוּ.
human_translation: What is different about those which one is not flogged? that they are a general prohibition, These too, are a prohibition that does not involve an action,
llm_translation: What is different about this one that he is not beaten? Because he is not included. Those others are also not ones that involve action.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, דְּאָמַר: לָאו שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ מַעֲשֶׂה – לוֹקִין עָלָיו.
human_translation: That in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda, who says a prohibition that does not involve an action one is flogged for it.
llm_translation: That one like Rabbi Yehuda, who said: "If it does not have an action - they flog him."

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: ״לֹא תוֹתִירוּ מִמֶּנּוּ עַד בֹּקֶר״ – בָּא הַכָּתוּב לִיתֵּן עֲשֵׂה אַחַר לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה,
human_translation: As it is taught “And you shall not leave any of it until morning; The verse comes to provide a positive after the prohibition
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: "Do not leave any of it until morning" - the verse comes to give a positive command after a negative command.

hebrew_text: לוֹמַר שֶׁאֵין לוֹקִין עָלָיו, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: to say that one is not flogged for the statement of Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: To say that they do not flog him, the words of Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב אוֹמֵר: לֹא מִן הַשֵּׁם הוּא זֶה, אֶלָּא מִשּׁוּם דְּהָוֵה לֵיהּ לָאו שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ מַעֲשֶׂה, וְכׇל לָאו שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ מַעֲשֶׂה אֵין לוֹקִין עָלָיו.
human_translation: Rabbi Ya’akov says: This is not for reason. Rather, because it is a prohibition that does not involve an action. And one is not flogged for any prohibition that does not involve an action.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yaakov says: Not from the name is this, rather because it is not that it has no action, and any that has no action, one does not receive punishment for it.

hebrew_text: מִכְּלָל דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה סָבַר: לוֹקִין עָלָיו.
human_translation: By inference, Rabbi Yehuda holds one is flogged for
llm_translation: From the principle of Rabbi Yehuda, he holds: they flog him.

hebrew_text: הַנּוֹדֵר בִּשְׁמוֹ וְהַמְקַיֵּים בִּשְׁמוֹ, הֲרֵי זֶה בְּלֹא תַעֲשֶׂה. הַנּוֹדֵר בִּשְׁמוֹ וְהַמְקַיֵּים בִּשְׁמוֹ, מְנָלַן?
human_translation: one who vows in name of and one who affirms in its name, this of a prohibition. From where do we one who vows in name of and one who affirms in its name
llm_translation: The one who vows in his name and the one who fulfills in his name, this is without a negative commandment. The one who vows in his name and the one who fulfills in his name, from where do we derive this?

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: ״וְשֵׁם אֱלֹהִים אֲחֵרִים לֹא תַזְכִּירוּ״ – שֶׁלֹּא יֹאמַר אָדָם לַחֲבֵירוֹ ״שְׁמוֹר לִי בְּצַד עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה פְּלוֹנִית״. ״לֹא יִשָּׁמַע עַל פִּיךָ״ – שֶׁלֹּא יִדּוֹר בִּשְׁמוֹ וְלֹא יְקַיֵּים בִּשְׁמוֹ, וְלֹא יִגְרוֹם לַאֲחֵרִים שִׁידְּרוּ בִּשְׁמוֹ וְשֶׁיְּקַיְּימוּ בִּשְׁמוֹ.
human_translation: As it is taught “And make no mention of the name of the other gods, that a person may not say to another: Wait for me next to such and such idol worship. “neither let it be heard out of your mouth” that may not vow in name of nor affirm in its name, nor cause others, to vow in its name or affirm in its name.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: "And you shall not mention the name of other gods" - that a person should not say to his fellow, "Watch over for me in the service of a certain idol." "It shall not be heard on your mouth" - that he should not make a vow in his name and not fulfill it in his name, and not cause others to make a vow in his name and that they fulfill it in his name.

hebrew_text: דָּבָר אַחֵר: ״לֹא יִשָּׁמַע עַל פִּיךָ״ – אַזְהָרָה לַמֵּסִית וְלַמַּדִּיחַ.
human_translation: Alternatively, “neither let it be heard out of your mouth” a prohibition against one who incites and against one who subverts
llm_translation: Another explanation: "Do not listen to your mouth" - a warning to the seducer and the persuader.

hebrew_text: מֵסִית, בְּהֶדְיָא כְּתִיב בֵּיהּ: ״וְכׇל יִשְׂרָאֵל יִשְׁמְעוּ וְיִרָאוּ וְגוֹ׳״. אֶלָּא, אַזְהָרָה לַמַּדִּיחַ.
human_translation: an inciter It is written explicitly in that regard, “And all Israel shall hear, and fear, Rather, a prohibition against one who subverts
llm_translation: Talmudic text: A "mesit," it is written in it: "And all Israel shall hear and fear, etc." Rather, a warning for the enticer. English translation: A "mesit," it is written in it: "And all Israel shall hear and fear, etc." Rather, a warning for the enticer.

hebrew_text: וְלֹא יִגְרוֹם לַאֲחֵרִים שֶׁיִּדְּרוּ בִּשְׁמוֹ וְשֶׁיְּקַיְּימוּ בִּשְׁמוֹ. מְסַיְּיעָא לֵיהּ לַאֲבוּהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל, דְּאָמַר אֲבוּהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל: אָסוּר לְאָדָם שֶׁיַּעֲשֶׂה שׁוּתָּפוּת עִם הַנׇּכְרִי, שֶׁמָּא יִתְחַיֵּיב לוֹ שְׁבוּעָה וְנִשְׁבָּע בַּעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה שֶׁלּוֹ, וְהַתּוֹרָה אָמְרָה: ״לֹא יִשָּׁמַע עַל פִּיךָ״.
human_translation: And not cause others, to vow in name of or affirm in its name. supports Shmuel’s father, as Shmuel’s father says: It is prohibited for a person to enter a partnership with a gentile, lest will be obligated to take an oath to him, and he will take an oath in his idol worship; and the Torah states: “Neither let it be heard out of your mouth,”
llm_translation: And not cause others to vow in his name and fulfill in his name. It is supportive to the statement of the father of Shmuel, as the father of Shmuel said: It is forbidden for a person to enter into a partnership with a non-Jew, lest he become obligated to him through an oath and swear in his foreign worship, and the Torah said: "You shall not swear by his name."

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא עוּלָּא, בָּת בְּקַלְנְבוֹ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא: וְהֵיכָא בָּת מָר? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בְּקַלְנְבוֹ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: וְהָכְתִיב ״וְשֵׁם אֱלֹהִים אֲחֵרִים לֹא תַזְכִּירוּ״? אֲמַר לֵיהּ, הָכִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כׇּל עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה הַכְּתוּבָה בַּתּוֹרָה – מוּתָּר לְהַזְכִּיר שְׁמָהּ. וְהָא הֵיכָא כְּתִיבָא? דִּכְתִיב: ״כָּרַע בֵּל קֹרֵס נְבוֹ״.
human_translation: When Ulla came he lodged in Kalnevo. Rava said to him: And where did the Master lodge? said to him: In Kalnevo. said to him: But isn’t it written: “And make no mention of the name of the other gods”? said to him: This Rabbi Yoḥanan said: any idol worship that is written in the Torah, it is permitted to mention its name. And where is this written? As it is written: “Bel bows down, Nevo stoops”
llm_translation: When Ulla came, the daughter of Kalnevo. Rava said to him: Where is the daughter of a master? He said to him: In Kalnevo. He said to him: But isn't it written, "And you shall not mention the name of other gods"? He said to him, so said Rabbi Yochanan: Any foreign worship mentioned in the Torah - it is permitted to mention its name. And where is this written? As it is written: "Kara Bel Korez Nevo."

hebrew_text: וְאִי לָא כְּתִיבָא – לָא? מֵתִיב רַב מְשַׁרְשְׁיָא: רָאָה אַחַת מְרוּבָּה כְּשָׁלֹשׁ, שֶׁהִיא כְּמִגַּדְיוֹן לְשִׁילֹה, שֶׁהֵן שְׁתֵּי טְבִילוֹת וּשְׁנֵי סְפוֹגִין – הֲרֵי זֶה זָב גָּמוּר. אָמַר רָבִינָא: גַּד נָמֵי מִכְתָּב כְּתִיב, דִּכְתִיב ״הָעֹרְכִים לַגַּד שֻׁלְחָן״.
human_translation: And if is not written not Rav Mesharshiyya raises an objection saw, one as long as three which is like from Gadyon to Shiloh, which is two immersions and two dryings he is a full-fledged zav , Ravina says: Gad is also written as it is written: “That prepare a table for Gad”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And if it is not written – not? It was taught by Rav Mesharshaya: He saw a woman with an excessive discharge like three, which is like a cloth for Shiloh, which are two immersions and two sponges - this one is a complete zav. Ravina said: The word "Gad" is also written, as it is written "those who set the table for Gad." English translation:

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: כֹּל לֵיצָנוּתָא אֲסִירָא, חוּץ מִלֵּיצָנוּתָא דַּעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה דְּשַׁרְיָא, דִּכְתִיב: ״כָּרַע בֵּל קֹרֵס נְבוֹ ... קָרְסוּ כָרְעוּ יַחְדָּו לֹא יָכְלוּ מַלֵּט מַשָּׂא״.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman says: All mockery are forbidden, except for mockery of idol worship, which is permitted, as it is written: “Bel crouches down, Nevo stoops…they stoop, they crouch down together, they could not hold back the burden”
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said: All mockery is forbidden, except for the mockery of idolatry, which is permitted, as it is written: "Bel bows down, Nevo stoops... They stoop, they bow down together; they could not save the burden."

hebrew_text: וּכְתִיב: ״דִּבְּרוּ ... לְעֶגְלוֹת בֵּית אָוֶן יָגוּרוּ שְׁכַן שֹׁמְרוֹן כִּי אָבַל עָלָיו עַמּוֹ וּכְמָרָיו עָלָיו יָגִילוּ עַל כְּבוֹדוֹ כִּי גָּלָה מִמֶּנּוּ״. אַל תִּקְרֵי ״כְּבוֹדוֹ״, אֶלָּא ״כְּבֵידוֹ״.
human_translation: And it is written: “They speak…the inhabitants of Samaria shall be in dread for the calves of Beth Aven; for its people shall mourn over it, and its priests shall tremble for it, for its glory [ kevodo ], because it has departed from it” Do not read “its glory [ kevodo ]”; rather, its burden [ keveido ],
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it is written: "Speak ... to the calves of Beth-aven, they shall tremble; for the people of Samaria shall mourn over it, and its priests shall rejoice over it, for its glory has departed from it." Do not read "its glory," rather "its burden." English translation:

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: מַאי דִּכְתִיב ״וְעַתָּה יוֹסִפוּ לַחֲטֹא וַיַּעְשׂוּ לָהֶם מַסֵּכָה מִכַּסְפָּם כִּתְבוּנָם עֲצַבִּים וְגוֹ׳״ – מַאי ״כִּתְבוּנָם עֲצַבִּים״? מְלַמֵּד שֶׁכׇּל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד עֹשֶׂה דְּמוּת יִרְאָתוֹ וּמַנִּיחָהּ בְּכִיסוֹ, בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁזּוֹכְרָהּ מוֹצִיאָהּ מִתּוֹךְ חֵיקוֹ וּמְחַבְּקָהּ וּמְנַשְּׁקָהּ.
human_translation: Rav Yitzḥak says: What which is written: “And now they continue to sin, and have made for themselves molten images of their silver, according to their own understanding, idols, What “According to their own understanding [ kitvunam ], idols”? teaches that each and every would make an image of his god and place it in his pocket. When he would remember it, he would remove it from his bosom and embrace it and kiss it.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yitzchak said: What is the meaning of what is written, "And now they continue to sin and make for themselves molten images, idols of their silver, according to their own understanding, all of them the work of craftsmen, etc." (Hosea 13:2)? What is meant by "according to their own understanding"? This teaches that each and every person makes an image of his fear and places it in his pocket. When he remembers it, he takes it out from his bosom, kisses it, and worships it.

hebrew_text: מַאי ״זֹבְחֵי אָדָם עֲגָלִים יִשָּׁקוּן״? אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק דְּבֵי רַבִּי אַמֵּי: שֶׁהָיוּ כּוֹמָרִים נוֹתְנִים עֵינֵיהֶם בְּבַעֲלֵי מָמוֹן, וּמַרְעִיבִים אֶת הָעֲגָלִים, וְעוֹשִׂין דְּמוּת עֲצַבִּים, וּמַעֲמִידִין בְּצַד אֲבוּסֵיהֶן, וּמוֹצִיאִין אוֹתָן לַחוּץ. כֵּיוָן שֶׁרָאוּ אוֹתָן רָצִין אַחֲרֵיהֶן וּמְמַשְׁמְשִׁין בָּהֶן, אוֹמְרִים לוֹ: עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה חָפֵץ בְּךָ, יָבֹא וְיִזְבַּח עַצְמוֹ לוֹ.
human_translation: What “Those who sacrifice men kiss calves”? Rabbi Yitzḥak of the school of Rabbi Ami says: that priests would set their eyes on the wealthy, and starve the calves and make statues image and place next to the troughs of and take outside. When see run after them and paw them. say to idol worship, desires you; let come and sacrifice himself to it.
llm_translation: What is the meaning of "The sacrificers of men kiss calves"? Rabbi Yitzchak of the school of Rabbi Ammi said: They were priests who would cast their eyes on wealthy individuals, and would starve the calves, and would make them into images of idols, and would place them by their mangers, and would take them outside. Once they saw them running after them and serving them, they would say to him: "A foreign worship desires you, come and sacrifice yourself to it."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: הַאי ״זֹבְחֵי אָדָם עֲגָלִים יִשָּׁקוּן״? ״עֲגָלִים יִשָּׁקוּן לִזְבֹּחַ אָדָם״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ! אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: כׇּל הַזּוֹבֵחַ אֶת בְּנוֹ לַעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה, אֹמֵר לוֹ: דּוֹרוֹן גָּדוֹל הִקְרִיב לוֹ, יָבֹא וְיִשַּׁק לוֹ.
human_translation: Rava says: That “those who sacrifice men kiss calves” should have They make calves kiss to sacrifice men. Rather, Rava says anyone sacrifices his son to idol worship, says to him: has sacrificed a great gift [ doron ] to come and kiss it.
llm_translation: Rava said: "This, 'The slaughterers of men shall kiss calves'? 'Calves shall kiss to slaughter men' - what does it require for him! Rather, Rava said: Whoever sacrifices his son for idol worship, it says to him: 'A great gift he offered to him, let him come and kiss him.'"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: ״וְאַנְשֵׁי בָבֶל עָשׂוּ אֶת סֻכּוֹת בְּנוֹת״, וּמַאי נִיהוּ? תַּרְנְגוֹלֶת. ״וְאַנְשֵׁי כוּת עָשׂוּ אֶת נֵרְגַל״, וּמַאי נִיהוּ? תַּרְנְגוֹל. ״וְאַנְשֵׁי חֲמָת עָשׂוּ אֶת אֲשִׁימָא״, וּמַאי נִיהוּ? בַּרְחָא קַרְחָא. ״וְהָעַוִּים עָשׂוּ אֶת נִבְחָן וְאֶת תַּרְתָּק״, וּמַאי נִיהוּ? כֶּלֶב וַחֲמוֹר.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Rav says “And the men of Babylonia made Succoth-Benoth” and what is a hen. “And the men of Cuth made Nergal” and what is it? a rooster. “And the men of Hamath made Ashima” and what is it? a bald billy goat. “And the Avvites made Nibhaz and Tartak” and what are they? a dog and a donkey.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: "The people of Babylon made their sukkot out of daughters," what is the meaning of this? Chicken. "The people of Kut made their shoes," what is the meaning of this? Chicken. "The people of Hamat made their garments," what is the meaning of this? Wool and linen. "The Avvim made their vessels and their spoons," what is the meaning of this? Dog and donkey.

hebrew_text: ״וְהַסְפַרְוִים שֹׂרְפִים אֶת בְּנֵיהֶם וְאֶת בְּנוֹתֵיהֶם בָּאֵשׁ לְאַדְרַמֶּלֶךְ וַעֲנַמֶּלֶךְ אֱלֹהֵי סְפַרְוָיִם״, וּמַאי נִיהוּ? הַפֶּרֶד וְהַסּוּס. אַדְרַמֶּלֶךְ – דְּאָדַר לֵיהּ לְמָרֵיהּ בִּטְעִינָה, וַעֲנַמֶּלֶךְ – דְּעָנֵי לֵיהּ לְמָרֵיהּ בִּקְרָבָא.
human_translation: “And the Sepharvites burned their sons and their daughters in the fire to Adrammelech and Anammelech, the gods of Sepharvaim” and what are they? The mule and the horse. Adrammelech because it honors [ addar ] its master with load, and Anammelech because it responds [ anei ] to its master, in battle.
llm_translation: "And the Sepharvites burned their sons and their daughters in the fire to Adrammelech and Anammelech, the gods of Sepharvaim." What are they? The mule and the horse. Adrammelech - because they adorn him for his master with a saddle, and Anammelech - because they respond to him for his master in battle.

hebrew_text: אַף חִזְקִיָּה מֶלֶךְ יְהוּדָה בִּיקֵּשׁ אָבִיו לַעֲשׂוֹת לוֹ כֵּן, אֶלָּא שֶׁסָּכַתּוּ אִמּוֹ סָלָמַנְדְּרָא.
human_translation: The father of Hezekiah, king of Judea, also attempted to do so to him, but his mother rubbed him a salamander [ salamandera ],
llm_translation: Even Hezekiah king of Judah sought to act thus, but his mother restrained him.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: יוֹדְעִין הָיוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל בַּעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה שֶׁאֵין בָּהּ מַמָּשׁ, וְלֹא עָבְדוּ עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה אֶלָּא לְהַתִּיר לָהֶם עֲרָיוֹת בְּפַרְהֶסְיָא.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Rav says: The Jewish people knew that idol worship is of no substance; And they worshipped idols only to permit themselves forbidden sexual relations in public,
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: The Israelites were knowledgeable in idol worship, which has no substance, and they only engaged in idol worship in order to permit themselves licentious behavior in public.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַב מְשַׁרְשְׁיָא: ״כִּזְכֹּר בְּנֵיהֶם מִזְבְּחוֹתָם וְגוֹ׳״, וְאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: כְּאָדָם שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ גַּעְגּוּעִין עַל בְּנוֹ?
