human_translation: Rav Mesharshiyya raises an objection “Like the memory of their sons are their altars, And Rabbi Elazar says like a person who misses his child.
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: "As they remember their altars and so forth." And Rabbi Elazar said: Like a person who has yearnings for his son?

hebrew_text: בָּתַר דַּאֲבִיקוּ בַּיהּ.
human_translation: after became attached to
llm_translation: After they argued about it.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: ״וְנָתַתִּי פִּגְרֵיכֶם עַל פִּגְרֵי גִּלּוּלֵיכֶם״. אָמַר: אֵלִיָּהוּ הַצַּדִּיק הָיָה מְחַזֵּר עַל תְּפוּחֵי רָעָב שֶׁבִּירוּשָׁלַיִם. פַּעַם אַחַת מָצָא תִּינוֹק שֶׁהָיָה תָּפוּחַ וּמוּטָל בָּאַשְׁפָּה.
human_translation: Come hear “And I shall cast your carcasses upon the carcasses of your idols” say Elijah the Righteous, would search for those who were swollen with hunger in Jerusalem. He once found a child who was swollen and lying in the garbage.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Come and hear: 'And I will lay your carcasses upon the carcasses of your idols.'" It was said: Elijah the righteous was walking among the starving apples in Jerusalem. Once he found a child who was an apple and lying in the garbage.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ: מֵאֵיזֶה מִשְׁפָּחָה אַתָּה? אָמַר לוֹ: מִמִּשְׁפָּחָה פְּלוֹנִית אֲנִי. אָמַר לוֹ: כְּלוּם נִשְׁתַּיֵּיר מֵאוֹתָהּ מִשְׁפָּחָה? אָמַר לוֹ: לָאו, חוּץ מִמֶּנִּי. אָמַר לוֹ: אִם אֲנִי מְלַמֶּדְךָ דָּבָר שֶׁאַתָּה חַי בּוֹ, אַתָּה לָמֵד? אָמַר לוֹ: הֵן. אָמַר לוֹ: אֱמוֹר בְּכׇל יוֹם ״שְׁמַע יִשְׂרָאֵל ה׳ אֱלֹהֵינוּ ה׳ אֶחָד״. אָמַר לוֹ:
human_translation: said to From which family are you? said to him: I am from such and such family. said to him: Isn’t left from that family? said to him: No besides me. said to him: If I teach you something through which you will live, will you learn said to him: Yes. said to him: Say every day “Listen Israel, the Lord is our God; the Lord is One” said to him:
llm_translation: He said to him: From which family are you? He said to him: I am from such and such family. He said to him: Nothing remained from that family? He said to him: No, except for me. He said to him: If I teach you something that you will live by, will you learn? He said to him: Yes. He said to him: Say every day "Hear, O Israel: the Lord our God, the Lord is one." He said to him:

hebrew_text: הַס, שֶׁלֹּא לְהַזְכִּיר בְּשֵׁם ה׳, שֶׁלֹּא לִימְּדוֹ אָבִיו וְאִמּוֹ.
human_translation: Hush, so as not to mention the name of the Lord which his father and his mother did not teach him.
llm_translation: "HaS, shelo lehazkir b'shem Hashem, shelo limmedo aviv ve'imo."

hebrew_text: מִיָּד הוֹצִיא יִרְאָתוֹ מֵחֵיקוֹ, וּמְחַבְּקָהּ וּמְנַשְּׁקָהּ, עַד שֶׁנִּבְקְעָה כְּרֵיסוֹ וְנָפְלָה יִרְאָתוֹ לָאָרֶץ, וְנָפַל הוּא עָלֶיהָ, לְקַיֵּים מַה שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְנָתַתִּי אֶת פִּגְרֵיכֶם עַל פִּגְרֵי גִּלּוּלֵיכֶם״. בָּתַר דַּאֲבִיקוּ בֵּיהּ.
human_translation: Immediately, removed his god from his bosom and hugging it and kissing it, until his stomach burst and his god fell to the earth and he fell upon it, in fulfillment of that is stated: “And I shall cast your carcasses upon the carcasses of your idols” after became attached to
llm_translation: Immediately he took out his fear from his bosom, and embraced and kissed it, until it split like a myrtle berry and his fear fell to the ground, and he fell upon it, to fulfill what is said: "And I will lay your corpses upon the corpses of your idols." After that, they embraced him.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: ״וַיִּזְעֲקוּ בְּקוֹל גָּדוֹל אֶל ה׳ אֱלֹהֵיהֶם״. מַאי אֲמוּר? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַב יוֹנָתָן: בִּיָּיא, בִּיָּיא! הַיְינוּ דְּאַחְרְבֵיהּ לְבֵיתָא, וְקַלְיֵאּ לְהֵיכְלָא, וְקַטְלִינְהוּ לְצַדִּיקֵי, וְאַגְלִינְהוּ לְיִשְׂרָאֵל מֵאַרְעַיְיהוּ, וַעֲדַיִין הוּא מְרַקֵּד בֵּינַן. כְּלוּם יְהַבְתֵּיהּ לַן אֶלָּא לְקַבּוֹלֵי בֵּיהּ אַגְרָא? לָא אִיהוּ בָּעֵינַן וְלָא אַגְרֵיהּ בָּעֵינַן! בָּתַר דַּאֲבִיקוּ בֵּיהּ.
human_translation: Come hear “And they cried in a loud voice to the Lord their God” What did they say Rav Yehuda says, and some say Rav Yonatan Woe, woe [ baya , baya ], this is what destroyed the Temple, and burned the Sanctuary, and murdered the righteous ones, and caused the Jewish people to be exiled from their land. And it still dances among us, Didn’t You give it to us solely for receiving reward We do not want it, nor do we not want its reward. after became attached to
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Come and hear: 'And they cried with a loud voice unto the Lord their God.'" What is meant by this? Rav Yehudah said, and some say it was Rav Yonatan: "Baya, baya! This is when the sword reached the house, the flame reached the sanctuary, they killed the righteous, exiled Israel from their land, and he is still dancing among them. Did He give it to us only to receive reward from us? Neither He nor His reward do we want! After they attached themselves to Him." English translation: "Come and hear: 'And they cried with a loud voice unto the Lord their God.'" What is meant by this? Rav Yehudah said, and some say it was Rav Yonatan: "Woe, woe! This is when the sword reached the house, the flame reached the sanctuary, they killed the righteous, exiled Israel from their land, and he is still dancing among them. Did He give it to us only to receive reward from us? Neither He nor His reward do we want! After they attached themselves to Him."

hebrew_text: יְתַבוּ תְּלָתָא יוֹמֵי בְּתַעֲנִיתָא, בָּעוּ רַחֲמֵי. נְפַל לְהוּ פִּיתְקָא מֵרְקִיעָא דַּהֲוָה כְּתִיב בַּהּ: ״אֱמֶת״.
human_translation: fasted for three days prayed for mercy. a note fell for them from the heavens in which was written: Truth,
llm_translation: They sat three days in fasting, they sought mercy. A note fell to them from the heavens, in it was written: "Truth."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ, חוֹתָמוֹ שֶׁל הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא ׳אֱמֶת׳.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina says: Conclude from it the seal of the Holy One, Blessed be He, is truth.
llm_translation: Rabbi Chanina said: Learn from it, the seal of the Holy One, blessed be He, is "truth."

hebrew_text: נְפַק כְּגוּרְיָא דְנוּרָא מִבֵּית קָדְשֵׁי הַקֳּדָשִׁים. אֲמַר לְהוּ נָבִיא לְיִשְׂרָאֵל: הַיְינוּ יִצְרָא דַּעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה. בַּהֲדֵי דְּקָתָפְסִי לֵיהּ, אִישְׁתְּמִיט בִּינִיתָא מִינֵּיהּ, וַאֲזַל קָלֵיהּ בְּאַרְבַּע מְאָה פַּרְסֵי. אָמְרוּ: הֵיכִי נֶיעְבֵּד? דִּילְמָא מִשְּׁמַיָּא מְרַחֲמִי עֲלֵיהּ.
human_translation: The form of a fiery lion cub came forth from the chamber of the Holy of Holies. the prophet, said to the Jewish people: This is the inclination for idol worship. When they caught hold of it one of its hairs fell out, and was heard for four hundred parasangs [ parsei ]. They said: What should we do Perhaps Heaven will have mercy upon it
llm_translation: He went out like a lion cub from the Holy of Holies. A prophet said to the Israelites: This is the inclination of foreign worship. As they were about to seize him, he threw a scroll from his hand, and it flew four hundred parasangs. They said: How shall we deal with him? Perhaps the heavens have mercy upon him.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לְהוּ נָבִיא: שַׁדְיוּהּ בְּדוּדָא דַאֲבָרָא, וְכַסְּיוּהּ בַּאֲבָרָא, דְּשָׁיֵיף קָלֵיהּ. דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיֹּאמֶר זֹאת הָרִשְׁעָה וַיַּשְׁלֵךְ אוֹתָהּ אֶל תּוֹךְ הָאֵיפָה וַיַּשְׁלֵךְ אֶת הָאֶבֶן הָעוֹפֶרֶת אֶל פִּיהָ״.
human_translation: The prophet said to them: Throw it into a container of lead and cover it with lead, as absorbs sound. As it is written: “And he said: This is the evil one. And he cast it down into the midst of the measure, and he cast a stone of lead upon its opening”
llm_translation: He said to them, a prophet: "Shadyuh in the pit of the well, and Kasiyuh in the pit, for he is light." As it is written: "And he said, 'This is the wickedness,' and he threw it into the midst of the ephah and threw the lead weight on its opening."

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי: הוֹאִיל וְעֵת רָצוֹן הוּא, נִיבְעֵי רַחֲמֵי אַיִּצְרָא דַעֲבֵירָה. בְּעוֹ רַחֲמֵי, אִימְּסַר בִּידַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: said: Since it is an auspicious time, let us pray for mercy concerning the inclination for sin They prayed for mercy, and it was delivered into their hands.
llm_translation: They said: Since it is a time of favor, the paths of mercy are open for transgressors. With the attribute of mercy, he is delivered into their hands.

hebrew_text: חַבְשׁוּהּ תְּלָתָא יוֹמֵי. בְּעוֹ בֵּיעֲתָא בַּת יוֹמָא לְחוֹלֶה, וְלָא אַשְׁכַּחוּ. אֲמַרוּ: הֵיכִי נַעֲבֵיד? נִיבְעֵי פַּלְגָא? פַּלְגָא מֵרְקִיעָא לָא יָהֲבִי. כַּחְלִינְהוּ לְעֵינֵיהּ. אַהֲנִי בֵּיהּ דְּלָא מִיגָּרֵי אִינִישׁ בְּקָרִיבְתֵּיהּ.
human_translation: imprisoned it for three days. searched for a one-day-old egg for the sick but could not find They said: What should we do? we pray for half, Heaven does not grant half They gouged its eyes, was effective in it that a person is no aroused to his relatives.
llm_translation: Bound him three days. On the eve of the Sabbath, to visit a sick person, and they did not find him. They said: What shall we do? Shall we split the sky? The sky does not give half. They looked at him. This is the one who does not leave a person in his vicinity.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּגוֹיָה אַחַת שֶׁהָיְתָה חוֹלָה בְּיוֹתֵר, אָמְרָה: אִם תַּעֲמוֹד הָהִיא אִשָּׁה מֵחוֹלְיָהּ, תֵּלֵךְ וְתַעֲבוֹד לְכׇל עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה שֶׁבָּעוֹלָם. עָמְדָה וְעָבְדָה לְכׇל עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה שֶׁבָּעוֹלָם. כֵּיוָן שֶׁהִגִּיעָה לִפְעוֹר, שָׁאֲלָה לַכּוֹמָרִים: בַּמָּה עוֹבְדִין לָזוֹ? אָמְרוּ לָהּ: אוֹכְלִין תְּרָדִין וְשׁוֹתִין שֵׁכָר וּמַתְרִיזִין בְּפָנֶיהָ. אָמְרָה: מוּטָב שֶׁתַּחֲזוֹר הָהִיא אִשָּׁה לְחוֹלְיָהּ וְלֹא תַּעֲבוֹד עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה בְּכָךְ.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Rav says: An incident involving a certain gentile woman who was very ill. She said: If that woman, recovers from her illness, she will go and worship every idol worship in the world. She recovered and worshipped every idol worship in the world. When she arrived at Peor she asked the priests: How does one worship this They said to her: One eats spinach, and drinks beer, and defecates before it. said: Better for that woman, to return to her illness, and not worship an idol in such a manner.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: There was an incident with a certain non-Jewish woman who was very ill. She said, "If that woman who is my nursemaid stands, go and serve any foreign worship in the world." She stood up and served any foreign worship in the world. When she reached the pit, she asked the priests, "With what do you worship this?" They said to her, "We eat radishes, drink beer, and dance before it." She said, "It is better that that woman should return to her illness and not serve foreign worship in this way."

hebrew_text: אַתֶּם בֵּית יִשְׂרָאֵל אֵינָן כֵּן, ״הַנִּצְמָדִים לְבַעַל פְּעוֹר״ – כְּצָמִיד פָּתִיל, ״וְאַתֶּם הַדְּבֵקִים בַּה׳ אֱלֹהֵיכֶם״ – כִּשְׁתֵּי תְּמָרוֹת הַדְּבוּקוֹת זוֹ בָּזוֹ.
human_translation: You, the house of Israel, are not like that “That have attached themselves [ hanitzmadim ] to Ba’al-Peor” like a tightly bound cover [ ketzamid patil ] “But you who did cleave [ hadevekim ] to the Lord your God” like two dates that attached [ hadevukot ] to one another
llm_translation: You, House of Israel, are not so, "those who cling to Baal Peor" - like a thread of flax, "but you who cling to the Lord your God" - like two palm branches clinging to each other.

hebrew_text: בְּמַתְנִיתָא תָּנָא: ״הַנִּצְמָדִים לְבַעַל פְּעוֹר״ – כְּצָמִיד עַל יְדֵי אִשָּׁה, ״וְאַתֶּם הַדְּבֵקִים בַּה׳ אֱלֹהֵיכֶם״ – דְּבוּקִים מַמָּשׁ.
human_translation: was taught in a baraita “That have attached themselves [ hanitzmadim ] to Ba’al-Peor” like a bracelet [ ketzamid ] on a woman’s arm, “But you who did cleave to the Lord your God” actually adhered
llm_translation: In the Mishnah it was taught: "Those who cling to Baal Peor" - like a bracelet on a woman's hand, "And you who cling to the Lord your God" - truly clinging.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּסַבְטָא בֶּן אַלָּס, שֶׁהִשְׂכִּיר חֲמוֹרוֹ לְגוֹיָה אַחַת. כֵּיוָן שֶׁהִגִּיעָה לִפְעוֹר, אָמְרָה לוֹ: הַמְתֵּן עַד שֶׁאֶכָּנֵס וְאֵצֵא. לְאַחַר שֶׁיָּצְאָה, אָמַר לָהּ: אַף אַתְּ הַמְתִּינִי עַד שֶׁאֶכָּנֵס וְאֵצֵא. אָמְרָה לוֹ: וְלֹא יְהוּדִי אַתָּה? אָמַר לָהּ: וּמַאי אִיכְפַּת לִיךְ? נִכְנַס, פָּעַר בְּפָנָיו וְקִינַּח בְּחוֹטְמוֹ. וְהָיוּ כּוֹמָרִין מְקַלְּסִין לוֹ וְאוֹמְרִים: מֵעוֹלָם לֹא הָיָה אָדָם שֶׁעֲבָדוֹ לָזֶה בְּכָךְ.
human_translation: The Sages taught: an incident involving Sabbeta ben Alas, who rented out his donkey to a certain gentile woman. when she arrived at Peor, she said to him: Wait until I go in and come out. After she came out, he said to her: You too wait until I go in and come out. She said to him: Aren’t you Jewish? He said to her: And what do you care? He entered and defecated before and wiped with its nostril, But the priests were praising him and saying: No person has ever worshipped it with this
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: There was an incident involving Sabta ben Allas, who rented his donkey to a non-Jewish woman. When she reached a narrow pass, she said to him: "Wait until I enter and exit." After she exited, he said to her: "You also wait for me until I enter and exit." She said to him: "But aren't you a Jew?" He replied: "And what difference does it make to you?" He entered, exposed himself before her, and urinated. The bystanders mocked him, saying: "Never has there been a man who degraded himself in this manner."

hebrew_text: הַפּוֹעֵר עַצְמוֹ לְבַעַל פְּעוֹר – הֲרֵי זֶה עֲבוֹדָתוֹ, אַף עַל גַּב דְּמִיכַּוֵּין לְבִיזּוּי. הַזּוֹרֵק אֶבֶן לְמַרְקוּלִיס – זוֹ הִיא עֲבוֹדָתוֹ, אַף עַל גַּב דְּמִיכַּוֵּין לְמִירְגְּמֵיהּ.
human_translation: one who defecates before Ba’al-Peor this is its worship, even if he intends to demean one who throws a stone at Mercury this is its worship, even if he intends to stone it.
llm_translation: The one who digs a pit for his fellow - this is his work, even though it may lead to disgrace. The one who throws a stone at a statue - this is his work, even though it may lead to idolatry.

hebrew_text: רַב מְנַשֶּׁה הֲוָה קָאָזֵיל לְבֵי תוֹרְתָּא. אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה הִיא דְּקָאֵי הָכָא. שְׁקַל פִּיסָּא, שְׁדָא בַּיהּ. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: מַרְקוּלִיס הִיא. אֲמַר לְהוּ: ״הַזּוֹרֵק אֶבֶן לְמַרְקוּלִיס״ תְּנַן.
human_translation: Rav Menashe was going to Bei Torta. said to him: There is idol worship situated here picked up a stone and threw at They said to him: It is Mercury, said to them: We learned one who throws a stone at Mercury
llm_translation: Rav Menasheh was sitting in the study hall. They said to him: It is a form of idolatry that you are engaging in here. He took a coin, threw it at him. They said to him: It is a form of Marculis. He said to them: "He who throws a stone at Marculis," we have learned.

hebrew_text: אֲתָא שְׁאַל בֵּי מִדְרְשָׁא. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: ״הַזּוֹרֵק אֶבֶן בְּמַרְקוּלִיס״ תְּנַן, אַף עַל גַּב דְּמִיכַּוֵּין לְמִירְגְּמֵיהּ. אֲמַר לְהוּ: אֵיזִיל אֶישְׁקְלַהּ. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: אֶחָד הַנּוֹטְלָהּ וְאֶחָד הַנּוֹתְנָהּ חַיָּיב, כֹּל חֲדָא וַחֲדָא רַוְוחָא לַחֲבֶירְתַּהּ שָׁבֵיק.
human_translation: went asked the study hall They said to him: We learned one who throws a stone at Mercury even if he intends to stone it said to I will go and take They said to him: Both one who removes it and one who places it is liable, each and every one leaves space for another
llm_translation: The scholars of the study hall came and asked: "We have learned that one who throws a stone into a public domain is liable, even though he intended to hit his target." He said to them: "I will go and weigh it." They said to him: "Whether one lifts it or places it down, both are liable, as each one contributes to the benefit of the other."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַנּוֹתֵן מִזַּרְעוֹ לַמּוֹלֶךְ, אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב עַד שֶׁיִּמְסוֹר לַמּוֹלֶךְ וְיַעֲבִיר בָּאֵשׁ. מָסַר לַמּוֹלֶךְ וְלֹא הֶעֱבִיר בָּאֵשׁ, הֶעֱבִיר בָּאֵשׁ וְלֹא מָסַר לַמּוֹלֶךְ – אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב עַד שֶׁיִּמְסוֹר לַמּוֹלֶךְ וְיַעֲבִיר בָּאֵשׁ.
human_translation: One who gives of his offspring to Molekh, is not liable unless he hands over to the Molekh and passes through the fire. he handed over to the Molekh but did not pass through the fire, he passed through the fire but did not hand over to the Molekh, he is not liable, unless he hands over to the Molekh and passes through the fire.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who gives his produce to the tax collector is not liable until he hands it over to the tax collector and it passes through fire. If he handed it over to the tax collector but did not pass it through fire, or if he passed it through fire but did not hand it over to the tax collector, he is not liable until he hands it over to the tax collector and it passes through fire.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ קָתָנֵי עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה, וְקָתָנֵי מוֹלֶךְ. אָמַר רַבִּי אָבִין: תְּנַן כְּמַאן דְּאָמַר מוֹלֶךְ לָאו עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה הִיא, דְּתַנְיָא: אֶחָד לַמּוֹלֶךְ וְאֶחָד לִשְׁאָר עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה – חַיָּיב. רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: לַמּוֹלֶךְ – חַיָּיב, שֶׁלֹּא לַמּוֹלֶךְ – פָּטוּר.
human_translation: idol worship are taught and Molekh are taught Rabbi Avin says: We learn according to the one who says Molekh is not idol worship as is taught one to the Molekh and one for other idols liable. Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, says: to the Molekh liable, not to Molekh, exempt.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara katanei avodah zaraha, ve'katanei molech. Amar Rabbi Avin: Tenan k'man de'amar molech l'avodah zaraha hi, de'tanya: echad lamolech ve'echad lishar avodah zaraha - chayav. Rabbi Elazar bar Rabbi Shimon omer: Lamolech - chayav, shelo lamolech - patur. English translation: The Gemara teaches about foreign worship, and it teaches about a molech. Rabbi Avin said: We learned in accordance with the one who says that a molech is not foreign worship, as it was taught: whether for a molech or for other foreign worship - one is liable. Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, says: For a molech - one is liable, for not for a molech - one is exempt.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן וְרַבִּי חֲנִינָא בֶּן אַנְטִיגְנוֹס אָמְרוּ דָּבָר אֶחָד. רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן – הָא דַּאֲמַרַן. רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בֶּן אַנְטִיגְנוֹס – דְּתַנְיָא: רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בֶּן אַנְטִיגְנוֹס אוֹמֵר, מִפְּנֵי מָה תָּפְסָה תּוֹרָה לְשׁוֹן ״מוֹלֶךְ״? כֹּל שֶׁהִמְלִיכוּהוּ עֲלֵיהֶם, אֲפִילּוּ צְרוֹר וַאֲפִילּוּ קֵיסָם.
human_translation: Abaye says: Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, and Rabbi Ḥanina ben Antigonus said the same thing, Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, that which we said. Rabbi Ḥanina ben Antigonus as it is taught Rabbi Ḥanina ben Antigonus says: For what does the Torah use the term Molekh? any that enthroned [ shehimlikhuhu ] over them even a pebble, or even a toothpick.
llm_translation: Abaye said: Rabbi Elazar the son of Rabbi Shimon and Rabbi Chanina ben Antigonus said one thing. Rabbi Elazar the son of Rabbi Shimon - this is what we said. Rabbi Chanina ben Antigonus - as it was taught: Rabbi Chanina ben Antigonus says, why did the Torah use the term "ruler"? To include even a small bundle and even a spoon.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: מוֹלֶךְ עֲרַאי אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: Rava says: between a temporary Molekh.
llm_translation: Rava said: One who walks in the marketplace, there is a difference between them.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יַנַּאי: אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב עַד שֶׁיִּמְסְרֶנּוּ לְכוֹמָרִין, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּמִזַּרְעֲךָ לֹא תִתֵּן לְהַעֲבִיר לַמֹּלֶךְ״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yannai says: not liable unless he hands him over to priests as it is stated: “And you shall not give any of your offspring to pass them over to Molekh”
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yannai: He is not liable until he hands it over to the priests, as it is stated: "And you shall not give any of your offspring to pass through for Molech."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: יָכוֹל הֶעֱבִיר וְלֹא מָסַר יְהֵא חַיָּיב? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״לֹא תִתֵּן״. מָסַר לַמּוֹלֶךְ וְלֹא הֶעֱבִיר, יָכוֹל יְהֵא חַיָּיב? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״לְהַעֲבִיר״. מָסַר וְהֶעֱבִיר שֶׁלֹּא לַמּוֹלֶךְ, יָכוֹל יְהֵא חַיָּיב? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״לַמֹּלֶךְ״.
human_translation: This is also taught might passed but did not hand over should be liable. the verse states: “You shall not give.” handed over to the Molekh but did not pass might he should be liable. the verse states: “To pass,” handed over and passed not to Molekh might he should be liable. the verse states: “To Molekh.”
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: If one was able to transfer an item but did not hand it over, is he liable? The Torah teaches "Do not give." If he handed it over to the recipient but did not transfer ownership, is he liable? The Torah teaches "to transfer." If he transferred and handed over an item not to the recipient, is he liable? The Torah teaches "to the recipient."

hebrew_text: מָסַר וְהֶעֱבִיר לַמּוֹלֶךְ, וְלֹא בָּאֵשׁ – יָכוֹל יְהֵא חַיָּיב? נֶאֱמַר כָּאן ״לְהַעֲבִיר״, וְנֶאֱמַר לְהַלָּן ״לֹא יִמָּצֵא בְךָ מַעֲבִיר בְּנוֹ וּבִתּוֹ בָּאֵשׁ״. מָה לְהַלָּן בָּאֵשׁ, אַף כָּאן בָּאֵשׁ. וּמָה כָּאן מוֹלֶךְ, אַף לְהַלָּן מוֹלֶךְ.
human_translation: handed over and passed over to the Molekh, but not through the fire, might he should be liable. It is stated here, “To pass,” and it is stated there, “There shall not be found among you one who passes his son or his daughter through the fire” Just as there, through the fire, so too here, through the fire. And just as here, Molekh, so too there, Molekh
llm_translation: He handed over and caused to pass to the molech, and not through fire - can one say he is liable? It is stated here "to cause to pass," and it is stated there "let there not be found among you one who causes his son or daughter to pass through fire." Just as there it is through fire, so too here it is through fire. And just as here it is to the molech, so too there it is to the molech.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרָבָא: הֶעֱבִיר כׇּל זַרְעוֹ – פָּטוּר, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״מִזַּרְעֲךָ״ – וְלֹא כׇּל זַרְעֲךָ.
human_translation: Rav Aḥa, son of Rava, says: passed all his offspring exempt, as it is stated: “Of your offspring,” But not all your offspring.
llm_translation: Rav Acha, son of Rava, said: If he passed all his seed - exempt, as it is said, "from your seed" - and not all your seed.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רַב אָשֵׁי: הֶעֱבִירוֹ סוֹמֵא, מַהוּ? יָשֵׁן, מַהוּ? בֶּן בְּנוֹ וּבֶן בִּתּוֹ, מַהוּ?
human_translation: Rav Ashi raises a dilemma: passed blind, what is asleep, what is his son’s son or his daughter’s son what is
llm_translation: Inquiries of Rav Ashi: He passed it over to a blind person, what is the ruling? He is asleep, what is the ruling? His grandson and his granddaughter, what is the ruling?

hebrew_text: תִּפְשׁוֹט מִיהָא חֲדָא, דְּתַנְיָא: ״כִּי מִזַּרְעוֹ נָתַן לַמֹּלֶךְ״ – מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר? לְפִי שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״לֹא יִמָּצֵא בְךָ מַעֲבִיר בְּנוֹ וּבִתּוֹ בָּאֵשׁ״, אֵין לִי אֶלָּא בְּנוֹ וּבִתּוֹ. בֶּן בְּנוֹ וּבֶן בִּתּוֹ מִנַּיִן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״בְּתִתּוֹ מִזַּרְעוֹ״.
human_translation: Resolve at least one as it is taught Why the verse state: “Because he has given of his offspring to Molekh” Because it is stated: “There shall not be found among you one who passes his son or his daughter through the fire,” I have only his son or daughter. From where his son’s son or his daughter’s son The verse states: “When he gives of his offspring”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Tifshot miha chada, d'tanya: 'Ki mizar'o natan la'melech' - mah talmud lomar? Lefi she'ne'emar 'Lo yimatzeh v'cha ma'avir b'no u'vito ba'esh', ein li ela b'no u'vito. Ben b'no u'ben b'ito minayin? Talmud lomar: 'Bitito mizar'o'." English translation: "You should rather derive it from another source, as it was taught: 'For he gave his seed to the king' - what is the Talmud teaching to say? Since it is stated, 'There shall not be found among you anyone who passes his son or his daughter through fire,' I have learned only his son and his daughter. How do I know this applies to his grandson and his granddaughter? The Talmud teaches to say: 'His daughter's son from his seed.'"

hebrew_text: תַּנָּא פָּתַח בְּ״כִּי מִזַּרְעוֹ״, וְסָלֵיק בְּ״תִתּוֹ מִזַּרְעוֹ״.
human_translation: tanna began with “because of his offspring,” and ended with “when he gives of his offspring.”
llm_translation: It was taught: He began with "from his seed" and concluded with "from his seed."

hebrew_text: דְּרָשָׁה אַחֲרִינָא הוּא: ״זַרְעוֹ״ – אֵין לִי אֶלָּא זֶרַע כָּשֵׁר, זֶרַע פָּסוּל מִנַּיִן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״בְּתִתּוֹ מִזַּרְעוֹ״.
human_translation: is a different exposition, “his offspring” I have only offspring unflawed From where offspring flawed The verse states: “When he gives of his offspring,”
llm_translation: A different interpretation is: "His seed" - I have only valid seed, how do I know that invalid seed is excluded? The Talmud teaches: "From his seed" (Leviticus 21:17).

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב עַד שֶׁיַּעֲבִירֶנּוּ דֶּרֶךְ הַעֲבָרָה. הֵיכִי דָּמֵי? אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: שְׁרָגָא דְּלִיבְנֵי בְּמִצְעֵי, נוּרָא מֵהַאי גִּיסָא וְנוּרָא מֵהַאי גִּיסָא.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says: not liable unless he passes him manner of passing. What is considered Abaye says: a latticework [ sirega ] of bricks in the middle, fire on this side and fire on that side.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said: He is not liable until he passes it through a thoroughfare. What is the case? Abaye said: A burning coal between two bundles, it is visible from this side and visible from that side.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: כְּמַשְׁוַורְתָּא דְּפוּרַיָּא.
human_translation: Rava says: like the leaps on Purim.
llm_translation: Rava said: Like the path of the gazelle.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּוָותֵיהּ דְּרָבָא: אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב עַד שֶׁיַּעֲבִירֶנּוּ דֶּרֶךְ עֲבָרָהּ. הֶעֱבִירוֹ בָּרֶגֶל – פָּטוּר.
human_translation: It is taught in accordance with Rava: not liable unless he passes manner of passing. If he passed him by foot, exempt.
llm_translation: It was taught in accordance with the opinion of Rava: One is not liable until he transports it in the manner of its transgression. If he transported it by foot - he is exempt.

hebrew_text: וְאֵינוֹ חַיָּיב אֶלָּא עַל יוֹצְאֵי יְרֵיכוֹ. הָא כֵּיצַד? בְּנוֹ וּבִתּוֹ – חַיָּיב, אָבִיו וְאִמּוֹ אָחִיו וַאֲחוֹתוֹ – פָּטוּר. הֶעֱבִיר עַצְמוֹ – פָּטוּר, וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן מְחַיֵּיב.
human_translation: And is liable only for his descendants. How so? his son or his daughter liable. his father, or his mother, his brother, or his sister, exempt. passed himself exempt. And Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, deems liable.
llm_translation: And he is only liable for those who come out of his thigh. How so? His son and daughter - liable, his father and mother, his brother and sister - exempt. If he sterilized himself - exempt, and Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Shimon obligates.

hebrew_text: אֶחָד לַמּוֹלֶךְ, וְאֶחָד לִשְׁאָר עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה – חַיָּיב. רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: לַמּוֹלֶךְ – חַיָּיב, שֶׁלֹּא לַמּוֹלֶךְ – פָּטוּר.
human_translation: Both to Molekh and to other idol worship liable. Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, says: to Molekh, liable, not to Molekh, exempt.
llm_translation: One for the one who walks, and one for other foreign service - liable. Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Shimon says: for the one who walks - liable, for not the one who walks - exempt.

hebrew_text: אָמַר עוּלָּא: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן? אָמַר קְרָא: ״לֹא יִמָּצֵא בְךָ״ – בְּךָ בְּעַצְמְךָ.
human_translation: Ulla says: What is the reason of Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, The verse states: “There shall not be found among you “among you” Among yourself.
llm_translation: Ula said: What is the reason for Rabbi Elazar the son of Rabbi Shimon's statement? The verse says, "There shall not be found among you" - within you, within yourself.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן לָא דָּרְשִׁי ״בְּךָ״? וְהָתְנַן: אֲבֵידָתוֹ וַאֲבֵידַת אָבִיו – שֶׁלּוֹ קוֹדֶמֶת. וְאָמְרִינַן: מַאי טַעְמָא? וְאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: אָמַר קְרָא ״אֶפֶס כִּי לֹא יִהְיֶה בְּךָ אֶבְיוֹן״ – שֶׁלּוֹ קוֹדֶמֶת לְשֶׁל כׇּל אָדָם.
human_translation: And do the Rabbis not interpret “among you” But didn’t we learn his lost item and his father’s lost item, his takes precedence. And we said What is the reason And Rav Yehuda said the verse states: “Only so that there shall be no needy among you” his takes precedence over of any person.
llm_translation: The Sages did not expound "in you"? And we learned: His lost object and his father's lost object - his own takes precedence. And we say: What is the reason? And Rav Yehudah said: The verse says, "For there will never cease to be poor in your land" - his own takes precedence over everyone else's.

hebrew_text: הָתָם מֵ״אֶפֶס״.
human_translation: And there, from “only,”
llm_translation: There, from "one" to "zero."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: שָׁלֹשׁ כָּרֵיתוֹת בַּעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה לָמָּה?
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, says: Why excision from the World-to-Come [ karet ] three with regard to idol worship?
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Chanina: Three "karaitot" in idolatry, why?

hebrew_text: אַחַת לִכְדַרְכָּהּ, וְאַחַת לְשֶׁלֹּא כְּדַרְכָּהּ, וְאַחַת לַמּוֹלֶךְ.
human_translation: One is for in its manner and one is for not in its manner and one is for Molekh.
llm_translation: One for her way, and one not for her way, and one for the one who leads.

hebrew_text: וּלְמַאן דְּאָמַר מוֹלֶךְ עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה הִיא, כָּרֵת בְּמוֹלֶךְ לְמָה לִי? לְמַעֲבִיר בְּנוֹ שֶׁלֹּא כְּדַרְכָּהּ.
human_translation: And according to the one who says Molekh is idol worship, why do I karet with regard to Molekh? for one who passes his child not its manner
llm_translation: And according to the one who says, "Performing a foreign service is a capital offense," why do I need a capital offense for performing a foreign service? To remove his son from following her the foreign service in its ways.

hebrew_text: וּלְמַאן דְּאָמַר: מְגַדֵּף עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה הִיא, כָּרֵת בִּמְגַדֵּף לְמָה לִי?
human_translation: And according to the one who says one who blasphemes is idol worship why do I karet with regard to one who blasphemes?
llm_translation: And according to the one who says: "Blaspheming idolatry it is, excision in blaspheming, why do I need?

hebrew_text: לְכִדְתַנְיָא: ״הִכָּרֵת תִּכָּרֵת״. ״הִכָּרֵת״ – בָּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה, ״תִּכָּרֵת״ – לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא.
human_translation: for that which is taught shall be excised [ hikkaret tikkaret ], “ Hikkaret ”; in this world, “ Tikkaret ”; in the World-to-Come, the statement of Rabbi Akiva.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "Lekidtanya: 'Hikareit Tikareit.' 'Hikareit' - in this world, 'Tikareit' - in the world to come, the words of Rabbi Akiva."

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: וַהֲלֹא כְּבָר נֶאֱמַר ״וְנִכְרְתָה״! וְכִי שְׁלֹשָׁה עוֹלָמִים יֵשׁ? אֶלָּא ״וְנִכְרְתָה״ – בָּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה, ״הִכָּרֵת״ – לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא, ״תִּכָּרֵת״ – דִּבְּרָה תוֹרָה כִלְשׁוֹן בְּנֵי אָדָם.
human_translation: Rabbi Yishmael said to him: But isn’t it already stated shall be excised [ venikhreta ]” Are there three worlds Rather, “ venikhreta ” in this world, “ hikkaret ” in the World-to-Come, tikkaret ,” the Torah spoke in the language of people.
llm_translation: He said to him Rabbi Yishmael: But has it not already been stated "and he shall be cut off"! Are there three worlds? Rather, "and he shall be cut off" - in this world, "he shall be cut off" - in the world to come, "it shall be cut off" - the Torah spoke in the language of people.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ בַּעַל אוֹב – זֶה פִּיתוֹם הַמְדַבֵּר מִשֶּׁחְיוֹ, וְיִדְּעוֹנִי – זֶה הַמְדַבֵּר בְּפִיו. הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ בִּסְקִילָה, וְהַנִּשְׁאָל בָּהֶם בְּאַזְהָרָה.
human_translation: A necromancer is a pitom from whose armpit speak. And a sorcerer is from whose mouth speak. These, are by stoning, and one who inquires through them is in a prohibition.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: "Ba'al Ov" - this refers to a necromancer who speaks from his armpit, and "Yid'oni" - this refers to one who speaks from his mouth. These are liable to stoning, and one who consults with them is warned.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי שְׁנָא הָכָא דְּקָתָנֵי בַּעַל אוֹב וְיִדְּעוֹנִי, וּמַאי שְׁנָא גַּבֵּי כָּרֵיתוֹת דְּקָתָנֵי בַּעַל אוֹב וְשַׁיְּירֵיהּ לְיִדְּעוֹנִי?
human_translation: What is different here, that teaches a necromancer and a sorcerer, and what is different in Karetot that teaches a necromancer but leaves out a sorcerer?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Why is it different here where it teaches "Ba'al Ov and Yidde'oni," and why is it different regarding the Karetot where it teaches "Ba'al Ov and those who remain for Yidde'oni"? English translation:

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: הוֹאִיל וּשְׁנֵיהֶן בְּלָאו אֶחָד נֶאֶמְרוּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: since both are stated in one prohibition.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: Since both of them were stated without a "negative commandment."

hebrew_text: רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר: יִדְּעוֹנִי, לְפִי שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ מַעֲשֶׂה.
human_translation: Reish Lakish says: A sorcerer because does not involve an action;
llm_translation: Reish Lakish said: They know me, because there is no deed in it.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, מַאי שְׁנָא בַּעַל אוֹב דְּנָקֵט? מִשּׁוּם דִּפְתַח בֵּיהּ קְרָא.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan, what is different a necromancer that uses because the verse introduces with it;
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan, what is the difference in the case of Baal Ov that is uprooted? Because a verse opens with it.

hebrew_text: וְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ, מַאי טַעְמָא לָא אָמַר כְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן? אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: חֲלוּקִין הֵן בְּמִיתָה.
human_translation: And what is the reason Reish Lakish did not say in accordance with Rabbi Yoḥanan? Rav Pappa says: because are divided with regard to death
llm_translation: Reish Lakish, what is the reason he did not say like Rabbi Yochanan? Rav Papa said: They differ in the matter of death.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: חֲלוּקָּה דְּלָאו – שְׁמָהּ חֲלוּקָּה, דְמִיתָה – לֹא שְׁמָהּ חֲלוּקָּה.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan a division of a prohibition, is considered a division of death is not considered a division
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan: A division that is not - its name is a division, if it resembles - not its name is a division.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, מַאי טַעְמָא לָא אָמַר כְּרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ? אָמַר לָךְ: מַתְנִיתִין דְּכָרֵיתוֹת רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא הִיא, דְּאָמַר: לָא בָּעֵינַן מַעֲשֶׂה.
human_translation: And what is the reason Rabbi Yoḥanan did not say in accordance with Reish Lakish, said to you the mishna of Karetot is Rabbi Akiva, who says we do not require an action
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan, what is the reason he did not say like Reish Lakish? He said to you: It is a Mishnah of Rabbi Akiva, for he said: We do not require an action.

hebrew_text: וְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: נְהִי דְּלָא בָּעֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא מַעֲשֶׂה רַבָּה, מַעֲשֶׂה זוּטָא בָּעֵי.
human_translation: And Reish Lakish although Rabbi Akiva does not require a significant action he does require a minor action.
llm_translation: Reish Lakish: "Yes, since Rabbi Akiva does not require the incident of Rabba, he requires the incident of Zuta."

hebrew_text: מְגַדֵּף, מַאי מַעֲשֶׂה אִיכָּא? עֲקִימַת שְׂפָתָיו הָוֵי מַעֲשֶׂה.
human_translation: a blasphemer, what action is there? The twisting of his lips is an action.
llm_translation: "Megadef, what is the case? The pursing of his lips is considered an act."

hebrew_text: בַּעַל אוֹב, מַאי מַעֲשֶׂה אִיכָּא? הַקָּשַׁת זְרוֹעוֹתָיו הָוֵי מַעֲשֶׂה.
human_translation: What action is there a necromancer? The striking of his arms is an action.
llm_translation: Ba'al Ov, what is the practical application? The bending of his arms is considered a deed.

hebrew_text: וַאֲפִילּוּ לְרַבָּנַן? וְהָתַנְיָא: אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב אֶלָּא עַל דָּבָר שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ מַעֲשֶׂה, כְּגוֹן זִיבּוּחַ, קִיטּוּר, וְנִיסּוּךְ, וְהִשְׁתַּחֲוָאָה.
human_translation: And even according to the Rabbis, But isn’t it taught is liable only for a matter that involves an action, e.g., sacrificing burning and pouring and bowing
llm_translation: And even for the Rabbis? And it was taught: He is liable only for something that involves an action, such as slaughtering, incense offering, libation, and prostration.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: מַאן תְּנָא הִשְׁתַּחֲוָאָה? רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא הִיא, דְּאָמַר: לָא בָּעֵינַן מַעֲשֶׂה. וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבָּנַן, כְּפִיפַת קוֹמָתוֹ לְרַבָּנַן הָוֵי מַעֲשֶׂה.
human_translation: And Reish Lakish says: Who taught bowing It is Rabbi Akiva, who says: We do not require action And Rabbi Yoḥanan says: You even say the Rabbis, the bending of one’s height, according to the Rabbis, is action.
llm_translation: And Reish Lakish said: Who is the Tanna of the prostration? It is Rabbi Akiva, as he said: We do not require an action. And Rabbi Yochanan said: Even if you were to say the Rabbis, his bowing to the Rabbis is considered an action.

hebrew_text: הַשְׁתָּא לְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ, כְּפִיפַת קוֹמָתוֹ לְרַבָּנַן לָא הָוֵי מַעֲשֶׂה, הַקָּשַׁת זְרוֹעוֹתָיו דְּבַעַל אוֹב הָוֵי מַעֲשֶׂה?
human_translation: Now according to Reish Lakish, the bending of one’s height is not action according to the Rabbis, the striking of the necromancer’s arms be action?
llm_translation: The question to Reish Lakish, if the bending of his height to the Rabbis is not considered an action, is the bending of the arms of Baal Ov considered an action?

hebrew_text: כִּי קָאָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ נָמֵי – לְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, אֲבָל לְרַבָּנַן – לָא.
human_translation: When Reish Lakish says also in accordance with Rabbi Akiva. But according to the Rabbis, not
llm_translation: When Reish Lakish said "nāmēi" - to Rabbi Akiva, but to the Rabbis - no.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, יָצָא מְגַדֵּף וּבַעַל אוֹב מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ!
human_translation: If so, should have Excluding a blasphemer and a necromancer,
llm_translation: If so, he has left a blasphemer and a necromancer to him!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר עוּלָּא: בִּמְקַטֵּר לַשֵּׁד.
human_translation: Rather, Ulla says: to one who burns to a demon
llm_translation: Rather, Ulla said: "By offering incense to demons."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא: מְקַטֵּר לַשֵּׁד – עוֹבֵד עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה הוּא! אֶלָּא, אָמַר רָבָא: בִּמְקַטֵּר לְחַבָּר.
human_translation: Rava said to One who burns to a demon is an idol worshipper, Rather, Rava says: to one who burns to gather
llm_translation: He said to him, Rava: One who burns incense to demons - he is performing idol worship! Rather, Rava said: When one burns incense, it should be for a friend.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: הַמְקַטֵּר לְחַבָּר – חוֹבֵר חָבֵר הוּא.
human_translation: Abaye said to One who burns to gather is a charmer,
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: One who smokes for his friend - he is considered a partner.

hebrew_text: אִין, וְהַתּוֹרָה אָמְרָה: חוֹבֵר זֶה בִּסְקִילָה.
human_translation: Yes, but the Torah states this charmer, by stoning,
llm_translation: There is no, and the Torah said: "One who ties this shall be stoned."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״חֹבֵר חָבֶר״ – אֶחָד חֶבֶר גָּדוֹל וְאֶחָד חֶבֶר קָטָן, וַאֲפִילּוּ נְחָשִׁים וְעַקְרַבִּים.
human_translation: The Sages taught a charmer both a gathering of large and a gathering of small and even snakes and scorpions.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: "A friend, a friend" - one is a great friend and one is a small friend, and even snakes and scorpions.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: הִלְכָּךְ, הַאי מַאן דְּצָמֵיד זִיבּוּרָא וְעַקְרַבָּא, אַף עַל גַּב דְּקָא מִיכַּוֵּין דְּלָא לַיזְּקוּ, אָסוּר.
human_translation: Abaye says: Therefore, this who gathers a hornet and a scorpion prohibited even if he intends to prevent them from harming
llm_translation: Abaye said: Therefore, one who ties a wolf and a scorpion together, even though they are not likely to harm each other, it is forbidden.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, מַאי שְׁנָא דִּכְפִיפַת קוֹמָתוֹ לְרַבָּנַן הָוֵי מַעֲשֶׂה, וַעֲקִימַת שְׂפָתָיו לָא הָוֵי מַעֲשֶׂה?
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan, what is different that the bending of one’s height is an action according to the Rabbis, but twisting of his lips is not an action?
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan, what is the difference that if one bends his height to the Rabbis it is considered an action, but if he bends his lips it is not considered an action?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: שָׁאנֵי מְגַדֵּף, הוֹאִיל וְיֶשְׁנוֹ בַּלֵּב.
human_translation: Rava says: a blasphemer is different, since is in the heart
llm_translation: Rava said: "A reviler is different, since he is in the heart."

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַבִּי זֵירָא: יָצְאוּ עֵדִים זוֹמְמִין, שֶׁאֵין בָּהֶן מַעֲשֶׂה. וְאַמַּאי? הָא לֵיתַנְהוּ בַּלֵּב!
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira raises an objection excluding conspiring witnesses, as do not involve an action. And why this is not in the heart;
llm_translation: Rebbe Zeira raises an objection: If witnesses who are conspiring have testified, when there is no act. And why? Because they did not give their testimony with sincerity!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: שָׁאנֵי עֵדִים זוֹמְמִין, הוֹאִיל וְיֶשְׁנוֹ בְּקוֹל.
human_translation: Rava says: Conspiring witnesses are different, since is through voice.
llm_translation: Rava said: Witnesses who are found to be conspiring are disqualified, since their voice is present.

hebrew_text: וְקוֹל, לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, לָאו מַעֲשֶׂה הוּא? וְהָא אִיתְּמַר: חֲסָמָהּ בְּקוֹל וְהִנְהִיגָהּ בְּקוֹל, רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: חַיָּיב, וְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר: פָּטוּר.
human_translation: And is voice not an action according to Rabbi Yoḥanan? But wasn’t it stated muzzled by voice, And led by voice, Rabbi Yoḥanan says liable, and Reish Lakish says exempt.
llm_translation: The voice, to Rabbi Yochanan, is it not an action? And it was stated: she locked it with a voice and led it with a voice, Rabbi Yochanan said: liable, and Reish Lakish said: exempt.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: חַיָּיב, עֲקִימַת פִּיו הָוֵי מַעֲשֶׂה. רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר: פָּטוּר, עֲקִימַת פִּיו לָא הָוֵי מַעֲשֶׂה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says liable, the twisting of mouth is an action, Reish Lakish says exempt, the twisting of mouth is not an action.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: obligated, the setting up of his mouth is considered an action. Reish Lakish said: exempt, the setting up of his mouth is not considered an action.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: שָׁאנֵי עֵדִים זוֹמְמִין, הוֹאִיל וְיֶשְׁנָן בִּרְאִיָּה.
human_translation: Rather, Rava says Conspiring witnesses are different, since they are through sight,
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said: Witnesses who are found to be conspiring are disqualified, since they are considered to be acting with intent.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: בַּעַל אוֹב – זֶה הַמְדַבֵּר בֵּין הַפְּרָקִים וּמִבֵּין אַצִּילֵי יָדָיו. יִדְּעוֹנִי – זֶה הַמַּנִּיחַ עֶצֶם יָדוּעַ בְּפִיו, וְהוּא מְדַבֵּר מֵאֵלָיו.
human_translation: The Sages taught: A necromancer is one who speaking between joints or from his armpit. A sorcerer [ yideoni ] is one who places a bone of a yadua in his mouth, and speaks on its own.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: "Ba'al Ov" - this refers to one who speaks between the joints and from between his elbows. "Yid'oni" - this is one who places a known bone in his mouth, and he speaks from it.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: ״וְהָיָה כְּאוֹב מֵאֶרֶץ קוֹלֵךְ״. מַאי לָאו, דְּמִשְׁתַּעֵי כִּי אוֹרְחֵיהּ? לָא, דְּסָלֵיק וְיָתֵיב בֵּין הַפְּרָקִים וּמִשְׁתַּעֵי.
human_translation: raises an objection “And your voice shall be as a ghost out of the ground” What, does not speak on his own? No, as rises and sits between the joints and speaks.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: A question was raised: "And your voice shall be like that of a ghost from the ground." What is the reason that it does not depart when its path is illuminated? Not because it ascends and sits between the gaps and departs.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: ״וַתֹּאמֶר הָאִשָּׁה אֶל שָׁאוּל אֱלֹהִים רָאִיתִי עֹלִים מִן הָאָרֶץ״. מַאי לָאו, דְּמִשְׁתַּעֵי כִּי אוֹרְחֵיהּ? לָא, דְּיָתֵיב בֵּין הַפְּרָקִים וּמִשְׁתַּעֵי.
human_translation: Come hear “And the woman said to Saul, I see a godlike being coming up out of the earth” What, does not that spoke on his own? No, as sits between the joints and speaks.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Come and hear: 'And the woman said to Saul, "I saw gods ascending from the earth."' What is the reason that she did not become startled when she saw them? Because she was sitting between the rows and became startled." English translation:

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: בַּעַל אוֹב – אֶחָד הַמַּעֲלֶה בִּזְכוּרוֹ, וְאֶחָד הַנִּשְׁאָל בְּגוּלְגּוֹלֶת. מָה בֵּין זֶה לָזֶה? מַעֲלֶה בִּזְכוּרוֹ – אֵינוֹ עוֹלֶה כְּדַרְכּוֹ, וְאֵינוֹ עוֹלֶה בַּשַּׁבָּת. נִשְׁאָל בְּגוּלְגּוֹלֶת – עוֹלֶה כְּדַרְכּוֹ, וְעוֹלֶה בַּשַּׁבָּת.
human_translation: The Sages taught: a necromancer both one who raises with his zekhur , and one who inquires from a skull [ begulgolet ]. What between this and that raises with his zekhur , does not rise in its manner, and does not rise on Shabbat. inquires from a skull, rises in its manner, and rises [ oleh ] on Shabbat.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: Ba'al Ov - one who ascends by his memory, and one who is borrowed in a skull. What is the difference between this and that? Ascending by his memory - he does not ascend in his usual manner, and he does not ascend on Shabbat. Borrowed in a skull - he ascends in his usual manner, and he ascends on Shabbat.

hebrew_text: עוֹלֶה? לְהֵיכָא סָלֵיק? הָא קַמֵּיהּ מַנַּח! אֶלָּא אֵימָא: עוֹנֶה כְּדַרְכּוֹ, וְעוֹנֶה בַּשַּׁבָּת.
human_translation: Rises? To where does rise? Isn’t lying before him? Rather, say answers in its manner, and answers [ ve’oneh ] on Shabbat.
llm_translation: Offering? To where does it ascend? Here it is placed before Him! Rather say: It answers in its own way, and it answers on Shabbat.

hebrew_text: וְאַף שְׁאֵלָה זוֹ שָׁאַל טוֹרָנוּסְרוּפוּס הָרָשָׁע אֶת רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא. אָמַר לוֹ: וּמָה יוֹם מִיָּמִים? אָמַר לוֹ: וּמָה גְּבַר מִגּוּבְרִין? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: דְּמָרִי צָבֵי. שַׁבָּת נָמֵי דְּמָרִי צָבֵי.
human_translation: The wicked Turnus Rufus, asked this question of Rabbi Akiva as well. said to him: And what day, from days? said to him: And what man, than men? said to him: because my master wants Shabbat too because my Master wants
llm_translation: And also this question Toranus Rufus the wicked asked Rabbi Akiva. He said to him: And what is day from days? He said to him: And what is man from men? He said to him: My master, the deer. Shabbat also is my master, the deer.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ, הָכִי קָאָמֵינָא לָךְ: מִי יֵימַר דְּהָאִידָּנָא שַׁבְּתָא? אָמַר לוֹ: נְהַר סַבַּטְיוֹן יוֹכִיחַ, בַּעַל אוֹב יוֹכִיחַ, קִבְרוֹ שֶׁל אָבִיו יוֹכִיחַ, שֶׁאֵין מַעֲלֶה עָשָׁן בַּשַּׁבָּת. אָמַר לוֹ: בִּיזִּיתוֹ, בִּיַּישְׁתּוֹ, וְקִילַּלְתּוֹ!
human_translation: said to him: This I say to you: Who is to say that now is Shabbat? said to him: The Sabbatyon River can prove A necromancer can prove The grave of his father, can prove as it does not emit smoke on Shabbat, said to him: You have demeaned you have shamed him, and you have cursed him
llm_translation: He said to him, thus I am saying to you: Who will say that the witness observed the Sabbath? He said to him: The river Sambatyon will testify, the spirit of Ov will testify, the grave of his father will testify, that he does not kindle a fire on the Sabbath. He said to him: You have despised him, you have disgraced him, and you have cursed him!

hebrew_text: שׁוֹאֵל אוֹב, הַיְינוּ ״וְדֹרֵשׁ אֶל הַמֵּתִים״!
human_translation: Isn’t inquires a necromancer “Or directs inquiries to the dead”
llm_translation: Asking an Ov, that is "inquiring of the dead"!

hebrew_text: דּוֹרֵשׁ לַמֵּתִים, כִּדְתַנְיָא: ״וְדֹרֵשׁ אֶל הַמֵּתִים״ – זֶה הַמַּרְעִיב עַצְמוֹ וְהוֹלֵךְ וְלָן בְּבֵית הַקְּבָרוֹת, כְּדֵי שֶׁתִּשְׁרֶה עָלָיו רוּחַ טוּמְאָה.
human_translation: directs inquiries to the dead as it is taught “Or directs inquiries to the dead”; this is one who starves himself and goes and sleeps in a graveyard so that a spirit of impurity should settle upon him,
llm_translation: One who inquires of the dead, as it was taught: "And inquires of the dead" - this refers to one who starves himself and goes and sleeps in the cemetery, so that an impure spirit may rest upon him.

hebrew_text: וּכְשֶׁהָיָה רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא מַגִּיעַ לְמִקְרָא זֶה הָיָה בּוֹכֶה, וּמָה הַמַּרְעִיב עַצְמוֹ כְּדַי שֶׁתִּשְׁרֶה עָלָיו רוּחַ טוּמְאָה – שׁוֹרָה עָלָיו רוּחַ טוּמְאָה, הַמַּרְעִיב עַצְמוֹ כְּדַי שֶׁתִּשְׁרֶה עָלָיו רוּחַ טׇהֳרָה – עַל אַחַת כַּמָּה וְכַמָּה. אֲבָל מָה אֶעֱשֶׂה שֶׁעֲוֹנוֹתֵינוּ גָּרְמוּ לָנוּ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי [אִם] עֲוֹנוֹתֵיכֶם הָיוּ מַבְדִּלִים בֵּינֵיכֶם לְבֵין אֱלֹהֵיכֶם״.
human_translation: And when Rabbi Akiva would arrive at this verse he would weep If one who starves himself so that a spirit of impurity will settle upon him a spirit of impurity settles upon him, all the more so one who starves himself so that a spirit of purity will settle upon him But what can I do, as our iniquities have caused us as it is stated: “But your iniquities have separated between you and your God,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And when Rabbi Akiva would reach this verse, he would cry. And what causes a person to become soiled so that an impure spirit rests upon him? If he makes himself soiled, an impure spirit rests upon him; if he makes himself pure, how much more so! But what shall I do, for our sins have caused this for us, as it is said: "For your iniquities have separated between you and your God."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: אִי בָּעוּ צַדִּיקֵי, בָּרוּ עָלְמָא, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי עֲוֹנוֹתֵיכֶם הָיוּ מַבְדִּלִים וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: Rava says: If the righteous wish they create a world, as it is stated: “But your iniquities have separated
llm_translation: Rava said: If the righteous suffer, the world will be destroyed, as it is stated: "For your iniquities have separated" etc.

hebrew_text: רָבָא בְּרָא גַּבְרָא. שַׁדְּרֵיהּ לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי זֵירָא. הֲוָה קָא מִשְׁתַּעֵי בַּהֲדֵיהּ, וְלָא הֲוָה קָא מַהְדַּר לֵיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִן חַבְרַיָּא אַתְּ, הֲדַר לְעַפְרָיךְ.
human_translation: Rava created a man, sent before Rabbi Zeira. would speak to him but he would not reply. said to him: You by the group, Return to your dust.
llm_translation: Rava son of Rava, sent him before Rabbi Zeira. He was drinking in his presence, and he was not honoring him. He said to him: "You are from my colleagues, honor your dust."

hebrew_text: רַב חֲנִינָא וְרַב אוֹשַׁעְיָא הֲווֹ יָתְבִי כׇּל מַעֲלֵי שַׁבְּתָא, וְעָסְקִי בְּסֵפֶר יְצִירָה, וּמִיבְּרֵי לְהוּ עִיגְלָא תִּילְתָּא, וְאָכְלִי לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rav Ḥanina and Rav Oshaya would sit every Shabbat eve and engage in Sefer Yetzira , and a third-born calf [ igla tilta ] would be created for them, and they would eat it
llm_translation: Rav Chanina and Rav Oshaya were sitting on every Shabbat, and they were engaged in the book of Yetzirah, and they would create for themselves a third-grown calf, and they would eat it.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״מְעוֹנֵן״ – רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: זֶה הַמַּעֲבִיר שִׁבְעָה מִינֵי זְכוּר עַל הָעַיִן. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: זֶה הָאוֹחֵז אֶת הָעֵינַיִם. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: זֶה הַמְחַשֵּׁב עִתִּים וְשָׁעוֹת וְאוֹמֵר ״הַיּוֹם יָפֶה לָצֵאת״, ״לְמָחָר יָפֶה לִיקַּח״, ״לִמּוּדֵי עַרְבֵי שְׁבִיעִיּוֹת חִטִּין יָפוֹת״, ״עִיקּוּרֵי קִטְנִיּוֹת מֵהֱיוֹת רָעוֹת״.
human_translation: The Sages taught: soothsayer Rabbi Shimon says: This is one who applies seven types of semen [ zekhur ] to eye And the Rabbis say: This is one who deceives the eyes, Rabbi Akiva says: This is one who calculates times and hours, and says, Today is propitious for going away tomorrow is propitious for purchasing on the eve of the Sabbatical wheat is generally good; uprooting legumes from going bad.
llm_translation: The sages taught: "Meonen" - Rabbi Shimon says: this refers to one who passes seven types of malevolent gazes over the eye. And the sages say: this refers to one who holds the eyes. Rabbi Akiva says: this refers to one who calculates times and hours and says, "Today is a good day to go out," "Tomorrow is a good day to buy," "On the eve of the seventh year, the wheat will be good," "The first fruits of figs will be bad."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״מְנַחֵשׁ״ – זֶה הָאוֹמֵר: ״פִּתּוֹ נָפְלָה מִפִּיו״, ״מַקְלוֹ נָפְלָה מִידּוֹ״, ״בְּנוֹ קוֹרֵא לוֹ מֵאַחֲרָיו״, ״עוֹרֵב קוֹרֵא לוֹ״, ״צְבִי הִפְסִיקוֹ בַּדֶּרֶךְ״, ״נָחָשׁ מִימִינוֹ״, וְ״שׁוּעָל מִשְּׂמֹאלוֹ״.
human_translation: The Sages taught: enchanter is one who says: bread fell from his mouth, staff fell from his hand, son calls him from behind, a raven calls to him, a deer blocks him on the way, a snake is to his right, or a fox is to his left,
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: "Menachesh" - this is one who says: "A crumb fell from his mouth", "His staff fell from his hand", "His son calls to him from behind", "A raven calls to him", "A deer interrupted him on the way", "A snake from his right", and "a fox from his left".

hebrew_text: ״אַל תַּתְחִיל בִּי״, ״שַׁחֲרִית הוּא״, ״רֹאשׁ חוֹדֶשׁ הוּא״, ״מוֹצָאֵי שַׁבָּת הוּא״.
human_translation: Do not me first, it is morning, it is the New Moon, It is the conclusion of Shabbat
llm_translation: "Do not start with me," "it is Shacharit," "it is Rosh Chodesh," "it is Motzaei Shabbat."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״לֹא תְנַחֲשׁוּ וְלֹא תְעוֹנֵנוּ״ – כְּגוֹן אֵלּוּ הַמְנַחֲשִׁים בְּחוּלְדָּה, בְּעוֹפוֹת, וּבְדָגִים.
human_translation: The Sages taught “Nor shall you practice divination nor soothsaying” for example, those who divine to a weasel, to birds, or to fish.
llm_translation: The sages taught: "Do not practice divination or soothsaying" - such as those who practice divination with a rod, with birds, and with fish.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַמְחַלֵּל אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת בְּדָבָר שֶׁחַיָּיבִין עַל זְדוֹנוֹ כָּרֵת, וְעַל שִׁגְגָתוֹ חַטָּאת.
human_translation: one who desecrates Shabbat by a matter that for its intentional karet and for its unwitting a sin-offering.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who desecrates the Sabbath intentionally is liable to karet, and unintentionally is liable to a sin offering.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מִכְּלָל דְּאִיכָּא מִידֵּי דְּחִילּוּל שַׁבָּת הָוֵי, וְאֵין חַיָּיבִין לֹא עַל שִׁגְגָתוֹ חַטָּאת וְלֹא עַל זְדוֹנוֹ כָּרֵת.
human_translation: By inference, there is matter that is a desecration of Shabbat, but for its unwitting one is not obligated a sin-offering, nor karet for its intentional
llm_translation: Gemara: From the general principle that there is liability for desecrating the Sabbath, and one is not liable neither for his unintentional sin nor for his intentional sin.

hebrew_text: מַאי הִיא? תְּחוּמִין, וְאַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא. הַבְעָרָה, וְאַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי.
human_translation: What is boundaries, and in accordance with of Rabbi Akiva, kindling in accordance with of Rabbi Yosei,
llm_translation: What is it? Techumim, and according to the opinion of Rabbi Akiva. Hav'arah, and according to the opinion of Rabbi Yosei.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַמְקַלֵּל אָבִיו וְאִמּוֹ אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב עַד שֶׁיְּקַלְּלֵם בַּשֵּׁם. קִלְּלָם בְּכִנּוּי, רַבִּי מֵאִיר מְחַיֵּיב וַחֲכָמִים פּוֹטְרִין.
human_translation: One who curses his father or his mother is not liable unless he curses them with the name he cursed them with an appellation Rabbi Meir deems liable, and the Rabbis deem exempt.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who curses his father and mother is not liable until he curses them by name. If he cursed them with a nickname, Rabbi Meir obligates him, but the Sages exempt him.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאן חֲכָמִים? רַבִּי מְנַחֵם בְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי הוּא. דְּתַנְיָא: רַבִּי מְנַחֵם בְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר, ״בְּנׇקְבוֹ שֵׁם יוּמָת״ – מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״שֵׁם״? לִימֵּד עַל מְקַלֵּל אָבִיו וְאִמּוֹ שֶׁאֵינוֹ חַיָּיב עַד שֶׁיְּקַלְּלֵם בַּשֵּׁם.
human_translation: Who are the Rabbis It is Rabbi Menaḥem, son of Rabbi Yosei. As it is taught Rabbi Menaḥem, son of Rabbi Yosei, says: when he blasphemes the name he shall be put to death” Why the verse state “the name” taught concerning one who curses his father or his mother, that he is not liable unless he curses them with the name
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Who is a wise man? Rabbi Menachem, son of Rabbi Yosei, he is. As it was taught: Rabbi Menachem, son of Rabbi Yosei, says, "With one who curses his father or his mother, 'he shall surely be put to death' - what does the Torah teach by saying 'name'? It teaches regarding one who curses his father and mother that he is not liable until he curses them using the Divine Name."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״אִישׁ״ – מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״אִישׁ אִישׁ״? לְרַבּוֹת בַּת, טוּמְטוּם, וְאַנְדְּרוֹגִינוֹס.
human_translation: The Sages taught: a man [ ish ] Why the verse state: any man [ ish ish ],” to include a daughter, one whose sexual organs are indeterminate [ tumtum ], and a hermaphrodite [ ve’androginos ].
llm_translation: The sages taught: "man" - what does the Scripture intend to convey by stating "man man"? To include a daughter, a eunuch, and an androgynos.

hebrew_text: ״אֲשֶׁר יְקַלֵּל אֶת אָבִיו וְאֶת אִמּוֹ״ – אֵין לִי אֶלָּא אָבִיו וְאִמּוֹ. אָבִיו שֶׁלֹּא אִמּוֹ, אִמּוֹ שֶׁלֹּא אָבִיו – מִנַּיִין? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אָבִיו וְאִמּוֹ קִלֵּל דָּמָיו בּוֹ״ – אָבִיו קִילֵּל, אִמּוֹ קִילֵּל. דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יֹאשִׁיָּה.
human_translation: “That curses his father and his mother,” I have only his father and his mother. From where his father but not his mother, his mother but not his father, the verse states: “His father and his mother he has cursed; his blood is upon him.” he cursed his father he cursed his mother; the statement of Rabbi Yoshiya.
llm_translation: "The one who curses his father or his mother" - I have only his father and his mother. His father without his mother, his mother without his father - from where? The Talmud teaches: "His father and his mother have cursed his blood" - his father cursed, his mother cursed. These are the words of Rabbi Yoshiyah.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן אוֹמֵר: מַשְׁמָע שְׁנֵיהֶן כְּאֶחָד, וּמַשְׁמָע אֶחָד בִּפְנֵי עַצְמוֹ, עַד שֶׁיִּפְרוֹט לְךָ הַכָּתוּב ״יַחְדָּו״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yonatan says: teaches both of them together, and it teaches one on their own, unless the verse specifies together,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yonatan says: Hear both of them as one, and hear one by itself, until the verse "together" is explicitly stated to you.

hebrew_text: ״מוֹת יוּמָת״ – בִּסְקִילָה. אַתָּה אוֹמֵר בִּסְקִילָה, אוֹ אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא בְּאַחַת מִכׇּל מִיתוֹת הָאֲמוּרוֹת בַּתּוֹרָה? נֶאֱמַר כָּאן ״דָּמָיו בּוֹ״, וְנֶאֱמַר לְהַלָּן ״דְּמֵיהֶם בָּם״. מָה לְהַלָּן בִּסְקִילָה, אַף כָּאן בִּסְקִילָה.
human_translation: “shall be put to death” by stoning. you say by stoning, or is it rather by one of all the death stated in the Torah? It is stated here: “His blood shall be upon him,” and it is stated below, their blood shall be upon them” Just as there by stoning, so too here, by stoning.
llm_translation: "Death shall surely be put to death" - by stoning. Do you say by stoning, or is it only with one of all the deaths mentioned in the Torah? It is stated here "his blood is upon him," and it is stated elsewhere "their blood is upon them." Just as there it is done by stoning, so too here it is done by stoning.

hebrew_text: עוֹנֶשׁ שָׁמַעְנוּ, אַזְהָרָה מִנַּיִין? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אֱלֹהִים לֹא תְקַלֵּל וְגוֹ׳״. אִם הָיָה אָבִיו דַּיָּין – הֲרֵי הוּא בִּכְלַל ״אֱלֹהִים לֹא תְקַלֵּל״, וְאִם הָיָה אָבִיו נָשִׂיא – הֲרֵי הוּא בִּכְלַל ״וְנָשִׂיא בְעַמְּךָ לֹא תָאֹר״.
human_translation: We have learned punishment from where prohibition The verse states: “You shall not blaspheme judges [ elohim ], If his father was a judge, is included in “You shall not blaspheme judges,” And if his father was a king, is included in “Nor curse a king of your people.”
llm_translation: Punishment we heard, warning from where? Scripture says: "You shall not curse God." If his father was a judge - he is included in "You shall not curse God," and if his father was a prince - he is included in "You shall not revile a ruler of your people."

hebrew_text: אֵינוֹ לֹא דַּיָּין וְלֹא נָשִׂיא, מִנַּיִין? אָמְרַתְּ: הֲרֵי אַתָּה דָּן בִּנְיַן אָב מִשְּׁנֵיהֶן. לֹא רְאִי נְשִׂיא כִּרְאִי דַּיָּין, וְלֹא רְאִי דַּיָּין כִּרְאִי נָשִׂיא.
human_translation: he is neither a judge nor a king, from where say: You derive a paradigm from both of them The characteristic of a king is not like the characteristic of a judge, and the characteristic of a judge is not like the characteristic of a king.
llm_translation: He is neither a judge nor a prince, from where? You say: You are judging the son from both of them. A judge is not like a prince, and a prince is not like a judge.

hebrew_text: לֹא רְאִי דַּיָּין כִּרְאִי נָשִׂיא, שֶׁהֲרֵי דַּיָּין – אַתָּה מְצוֶּּוה עַל הוֹרָאָתוֹ, כִּרְאִי נָשִׂיא – שֶׁאִי אַתָּה מְצֻוֶּוה עַל הוֹרָאָתוֹ. וְלֹא רְאִי נָשִׂיא כִּרְאִי דַּיָּין, שֶׁהַנָּשִׂיא – אַתָּה מְצוֶּּוה עַל הַמְרָאָתוֹ, כִּרְאִי דַּיָּין – שֶׁאִי אַתָּה מְצוֶּּוה עַל הַמְרָאָתוֹ.
human_translation: The characteristic of a judge is not like the characteristic of a king, as a judge, you are commanded with regard to his ruling. like the characteristic of a king, with regard to whose ruling you are not commanded And the characteristic of a king is not like the characteristic of a judge, as the king, you are commanded with regard to rebelling him, like the characteristic of a judge, as you are not commanded with regard to rebelling him.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Lo re'i dayan kir'i nasi, sheharei dayan - atah metzuvah al horato, kir'i nasi - she'ei atah metzuvah al horato. Ve'lo re'i nasi kir'i dayan, shehanasi - atah metzuvah al hamra'ato, kir'i dayan - she'ei atah metzuvah al hamra'ato." English translation: "The sight of a judge is not like the sight of a prince, for regarding a judge - you are commanded concerning his teaching, but regarding a prince - you are not commanded concerning his teaching. And the sight of a prince is not like the sight of a judge, for regarding a prince - you are commanded concerning his appearance, but regarding a judge - you are not commanded concerning his appearance."

hebrew_text: הַצַּד הַשָּׁוֶה שֶׁבָּהֶם שֶׁהֵן בְּעַמְּךָ, וְאַתָּה מוּזְהָר עַל קִלְלָתָן. אַף אֲנִי אָבִיא אָבִיךָ, שֶׁבְּעַמְּךָ, וְאַתָּה מוּזְהָר עַל קִלְלָתוֹ.
human_translation: Their common denominator is that they are “of your people,” and you are prohibited from cursing them. I too will include your father, as “of your people,” and you are prohibited from cursing him.
llm_translation: The side that is equal in them that they are in your people, and you are warned about their curse. Even I will bring your father, who is in your people, and you are warned about his curse.

hebrew_text: מָה לְהַצַּד הַשָּׁוֶה שֶׁבָּהֶן, שֶׁכֵּן גְּדוּלָּתָן גָּרְמָה לָהֶן?
human_translation: what about their common denominator, in that their prominence has caused them
llm_translation: What to the side the equal that in them, that so their greatness caused for them?

hebrew_text: תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״לֹא תְקַלֵּל חֵרֵשׁ״ – בְּאוּמְלָלִים שֶׁבְּעַמְּךָ הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר.
human_translation: The verse states: “You shall not curse the deaf, The verse speaks of the wretched of your people.
llm_translation: The Talmud teaches: "Do not curse a deaf person" - referring to those who speak in your presence, as the verse in your nation's language speaks.

hebrew_text: מָה לְחֵרֵשׁ, שֶׁכֵּן חֲרִישָׁתוֹ גָּרְמָה לוֹ?
human_translation: what about a deaf in that his deafness has caused him
llm_translation: What about a deaf person, that his silence caused it for him?

hebrew_text: נָשִׂיא וְדַיָּין יוֹכִיחוּ. מָה לְנָשִׂיא וְדַיָּין שֶׁכֵּן גְּדוּלָּתָן גָּרְמָה לָהֶן? חֵרֵשׁ יוֹכִיחַ.
human_translation: a king and a judge can prove what about a king and a judge is that their prominence has caused them deaf can prove
llm_translation: The prince and the judge shall prove. What for the prince and the judge that their greatness caused them? A deaf-mute shall prove.

hebrew_text: וְחָזַר הַדִּין. לֹא רְאִי זֶה כִרְאִי זֶה, וְלֹא רְאִי זֶה כִּרְאִי זֶה. הַצַּד הַשָּׁוֶה שֶׁבָּהֶן: שֶׁהֵן בְּעַמְּךָ, וְאַתָּה מוּזְהָר עַל קִלְלָתָן. אַף אֲנִי אָבִיא אָבִיךָ, שֶׁבְּעַמְּךָ וְאַתָּה מוּזְהָר עַל קִלְלָתוֹ.
human_translation: And the inference has reverted The characteristic of this is not like the characteristic of that and the characteristic of that is not like the characteristic of this their common denominator is that they are “of your people,” and you are prohibited from cursing them. I too will include your father, who “of your people,” and you are prohibited from cursing him.
llm_translation: The judgment returned. Not like this sight like this, and not like this sight like this. The equal side in them: that they are among your people, and you are warned about their curse. I will also bring your father, who is among your people, and you are warned about his curse.

hebrew_text: מָה לְצַד הַשָּׁוֶה שֶׁבָּהֶן, שֶׁכֵּן מְשׁוּנִּין?
human_translation: What about their common dominator? in that they are unusual,
llm_translation: What is the similarity between them that they are compared?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, אִם כֵּן נִכְתּוֹב קְרָא: אוֹ ״אֱלֹהִים וְחֵרֵשׁ״, אוֹ ״נָשִׂיא וְחֵרֵשׁ״. ״אֱלֹהִים״ לְמָה לִי? אִם אֵינוֹ עִנְיָן לְגוּפוֹ, תְּנֵהוּ עִנְיָן לְאָבִיו.
human_translation: Rather, If so let the verse write either judges and deaf, or a king and deaf, Why do I judges? if is not its own matter, apply it to the matter of father.
llm_translation: Rather, if so it is written in the verse: or "God and the deaf," or "a prince and the deaf." "God" - what do I need it for? If it is not relevant to his body, attribute it to his father.

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר ״אֱלֹהִים״ חוֹל, אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר קוֹדֶשׁ, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר?
human_translation: This works out well according to the one who says “ elohim ” is non-sacred, But according to the one who says sacred, what can be said?
llm_translation: He left it for the one who said "Elohim" is profane, but for the one who said "Kodesh," what can be said?

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: ״אֱלֹהִים״ – חוֹל, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: ״אֱלֹהִים״ – קוֹדֶשׁ. וְתַנְיָא: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב אוֹמֵר: אַזְהָרָה לִמְבָרֵךְ אֶת הַשֵּׁם מִנַּיִין? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אֱלֹהִים לֹא תְקַלֵּל״.
human_translation: As it is taught “ elohim ” non-sacred; the statement of Rabbi Yishmael. Rabbi Akiva says: “ Elohim ” is sacred. And it is taught Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov says: From where is the prohibition against one who blesses, the name The verse states: “You shall not blaspheme God [ Elohim ].”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: It was taught in a Baraita: "Elohim" - profane, the words of Rabbi Yishmael. Rabbi Akiva says: "Elohim" - holy. And it was taught: Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov says: From where is the warning for one who blesses the Name derived? The Talmud teaches: "You shall not curse God."

hebrew_text: לְמַאן דְּאָמַר ״אֱלֹהִים״ חוֹל – גָּמַר קוֹדֶשׁ מֵחוֹל, לְמַאן דְּאָמַר ״אֱלֹהִים״ קוֹדֶשׁ – גָּמְרִינַן חוֹל מִקּוֹדֶשׁ.
human_translation: According to the one who says “ elohim ” is non-sacred, he derives sacred from non-sacred According to the one who says “ Elohim ” is sacred, we derive non-sacred from sacred
llm_translation: To whom that said "Elohim" is profane - he concludes holiness from profane, to whom that said "Elohim" is holy - we conclude profane from holy.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר ״אֱלֹהִים״ חוֹל, גָּמַר קוֹדֶשׁ מֵחוֹל. אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר ״אֱלֹהִים״ קוֹדֶשׁ, גָּמַר חוֹל מִקּוֹדֶשׁ? דִּילְמָא אַקּוֹדֶשׁ אַזְהַר, אַחוֹל לָא אַזְהַר?
human_translation: Granted, according to the one who says “ elohim ” is non-sacred, he can derive sacred from non-sacred But according to the one who says “ Elohim ” is sacred, derive non-sacred from sacred Perhaps renders prohibited sacred it does not render prohibited non-sacred
llm_translation: In truth, according to the one who says "Elohim" is profane, he concludes holiness from profanity. But according to the one who says "Elohim" is holy, does he conclude profanity from holiness? Perhaps I will sanctify, is a warning, but perhaps I will profane is not a warning?

hebrew_text: אִם כֵּן, לִכְתּוֹב קְרָא: ״לֹא תָקֵל״!
human_translation: If so, let the verse write: You shall not treat lightly [ takel ],
llm_translation: If so, to write a verse: "Do not be light!"

hebrew_text: מַאי ״לֹא תְקַלֵּל״? שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ תַּרְתֵּי.
human_translation: What “You shall not curse [ tekallel ]”? Conclude from it two
llm_translation: What is "Do not curse"? Learn from it two.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַבָּא עַל נַעֲרָה הַמְאוֹרָסָה אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב, עַד שֶׁתְּהֵא נַעֲרָה, בְּתוּלָה, מְאוֹרָסָה, וְהִיא בְּבֵית אָבִיהָ. בָּאוּ עָלֶיהָ שְׁנַיִם, הָרִאשׁוֹן בִּסְקִילָה וְהַשֵּׁנִי בְּחֶנֶק.
human_translation: One who engages in intercourse with a betrothed young woman is not liable unless she is a young woman, a virgin; betrothed and she in her father’s home, two engaged in intercourse with her, the first by stoning, and the second by strangulation.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who engages in relations with a betrothed maiden is not liable until she is a maiden, a virgin, and betrothed, and she is in her father's house. If two men came upon her, the first is punished by stoning and the second by strangulation.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״נַעֲרָה״ – וְלֹא בּוֹגֶרֶת, ״בְּתוּלָה״ – וְלֹא בְּעוּלָה, ״מְאוֹרָסָה״ – וְלֹא נְשׂוּאָה, ״בְּבֵית אָבִיהָ״ – פְּרָט לְשֶׁמָּסַר הָאָב לִשְׁלוּחֵי הַבַּעַל.
human_translation: The Sages taught a young woman, but not a grown woman. a virgin but not a non-virgin. betrothed but not married. in her father’s home, excluding where the father transferred to the husband’s agents
llm_translation: The Sages taught: "Na'arah" - and not a Bogeret, "Betulah" - and not a Be'ulah, "Me'orasah" - and not a Nesu'ah, "Beit Aviha" - excluding when the father handed her over to the messengers of the husband.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: זוֹ דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר, אֲבָל חֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: נַעֲרָה הַמְאוֹרָסָה – אֲפִילּוּ קְטַנָּה בַּמַּשְׁמָע.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Rav says: This the statement of Rabbi Meir, But the Rabbis say: Even a minor is included in A betrothed young woman;
llm_translation: Said Rav Yehudah said Rav: This is the statement of Rabbi Meir, but the Sages say: A betrothed maiden - even a minor in age is considered legally betrothed.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַחָא מִדִּפְתִּי לְרָבִינָא: מִמַּאי דְּמַתְנִיתִין רַבִּי מֵאִיר הִיא, וּלְמַעוֹטֵי קְטַנָּה נָמֵי? דִּילְמָא רַבָּנַן הִיא, וּלְמַעוֹטֵי בּוֹגֶרֶת וְתוּ לָא?
human_translation: Rav Aḥa of Difti said to Ravina: From where that the mishna is Rabbi Meir, and also to the exclusion of a minor girl? Perhaps is the Rabbis, and to the exclusion of a grown woman and nothing more.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Acha, from the town of Difti, to Ravina: From where do we know that the Mishnah is according to Rabbi Meir, and to exclude the opinion of the minor? Perhaps it is according to the Rabbis, and to exclude the opinion of the butcher and the one who is not?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הַאי ״אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב עַד שֶׁתְּהֵא נַעֲרָה בְּתוּלָה מְאוֹרָסָה״ – אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב אֶלָּא עַל נַעֲרָה בְּתוּלָה מְאוֹרָסָה מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ! וְתוּ לָא מִידִּי.
human_translation: said to him: This Is not liable unless she is [ ad shetehe ] a young woman, a virgin, betrothed, it should have Is liable only for a young woman a virgin betrothed. And nothing more
llm_translation: He said to him: This "he is not liable until she is a young virgin betrothed" - he is liable only for a young virgin betrothed! And if not, from where does he derive it? But it is not from my words.

hebrew_text: בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב בַּר אַדָּא מֵרַב: בָּא עַל הַקְּטַנָּה מְאוֹרָסָה לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר, מַהוּ? לְגַמְרֵי מְמַעֵיט לֵיהּ, אוֹ מִסְּקִילָה מְמַעֵיט לֵיהּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִסְתַּבְּרָא מִסְּקִילָה מְמַעֵט לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Ya’akov bar Adda asked Rav: engaged in intercourse with a betrothed minor girl, what is according to Rabbi Meir? Does exclude him entirely, or does he exclude him from stoning said to him: It stands to reason excludes him from stoning
llm_translation: Requested by Rabbi Yaakov bar Adda from Rav: A case came before Rabbi Meir involving a minor who was betrothed. What is the ruling? Should we completely diminish her status, or should we diminish it through stoning? He said to him: It is more logical to diminish it through stoning.

hebrew_text: וְהָכְתִיב: ״וּמֵתוּ גַּם שְׁנֵיהֶם״, עַד שֶׁיְּהוּ שְׁנֵיהֶן שָׁוִין? שְׁתֵיק רַב.
human_translation: But isn’t it written: then they shall both die, unless they are both equally Rav remained silent
llm_translation: And it is written: "And both of them shall die," until they are both equal? Rav remained silent.

hebrew_text: אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: מַאי טַעְמָא שְׁתֵיק רַב? וְנֵימָא לֵיהּ: ״וּמֵת הָאִישׁ אֲשֶׁר שָׁכַב עִמָּהּ לְבַדּוֹ״!
human_translation: Shmuel says: What is the reason Rav remained silent? Why not say to then the man who lay with her alone shall die”
llm_translation: Samuel said: What is the reason Rav remained silent? And it can be said to him: "And the man who lay with her alone shall die!"

hebrew_text: כְּתַנָּאֵי: ״וּמֵתוּ גַּם שְׁנֵיהֶם״ – עַד שֶׁיְּהוּ שְׁנֵיהֶן שָׁוִין, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יֹאשִׁיָּה. רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן אוֹמֵר: ״וּמֵת הָאִישׁ אֲשֶׁר שָׁכַב עִמָּהּ לְבַדּוֹ״.
human_translation: subject to tanna’im , “Then they shall both die” unless they are both equally the statement of Rabbi Yoshiya. Rabbi Yonatan says “then the man who lay with her alone shall die”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: The Tannaim: "And they shall both die" - until they are both equal, the words of Rabbi Yoshiyah. Rabbi Yonatan says: "And the man who lay with her alone shall die."

hebrew_text: וְאִידָּךְ, הָהִיא ״וּמֵתוּ גַּם שְׁנֵיהֶם״ מַאי דָּרֵישׁ בֵּיהּ? אָמַר רָבָא: לְמַעוֹטֵי מַעֲשֵׂה חִידּוּדִים. וְאִידַּךְ? מַעֲשֵׂה חִידּוּדִים לָאו כְּלוּם הִיא.
human_translation: And what does the other derive from “Then they shall both die”? Rava says: to exclude an act of sharpening, And the other an act of sharpening is nothing;
llm_translation: The other one, that "and they shall both die," what is it that it seeks to teach? Rava said: To exclude cases of torture. And the other one? Torture is not considered as nothing.

hebrew_text: וְאִידָּךְ, הַאי ״לְבַדּוֹ״ מַאי דָּרֵישׁ בֵּיהּ?
human_translation: And what does the other derive from alone
llm_translation: And the other opinion, what does it expound in the phrase "alone"?

hebrew_text: כִּדְתַנְיָא: בָּאוּ עָלֶיהָ עֲשָׂרָה בְּנֵי אָדָם, וַעֲדַיִין הִיא בְּתוּלָה – כּוּלָּם בִּסְקִילָה. רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: הָרִאשׁוֹן בִּסְקִילָה, וְכוּלָּן בְּחֶנֶק.
human_translation: as it is taught ten men engaged in intercourse with and she is still a virgin, they are all by stoning. Rabbi says: The first by stoning, and all of them by strangulation.
llm_translation: As it was taught: Ten men came upon her, and she is still a virgin - all of them by stoning. Rabbi says: The first by stoning, and all of them by strangulation.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״וּבַת אִישׁ כֹּהֵן כִּי תֵחֵל לִזְנוֹת״, רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: תְּחִילָּה, וְכֵן הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״וּמֵת הָאִישׁ אֲשֶׁר שָׁכַב עִמָּהּ לְבַדּוֹ״.
human_translation: The Sages taught: “And the daughter of any priest, if she profanes [ teḥel ] herself by playing the harlot, Rabbi says: first [ teḥila ]; and likewise it says: “Then the man who lay with her alone shall die”
llm_translation: The sages taught: "And the daughter of a Kohen, when she begins to commit harlotry," Rabbi says: at first, and so he also says: "But the man who lies with her alone shall die."

hebrew_text: מַאי קָאָמַר? אָמַר רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: רַבִּי כְּרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל סְבִירָא לֵיהּ, דְּאָמַר אֲרוּסָה יָצְאָה לִשְׂרֵיפָה וְלֹא נְשׂוּאָה. וְהָכִי קָאָמַר: אִם תְּחִילַּת בִּיאָה בִּזְנוּת – בִּשְׂרֵיפָה, אִידַּךְ – בְּחֶנֶק.
human_translation: What is saying? Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, says: Rabbi holds in accordance with Rabbi Yishmael, who says betrothed is singled out for burning, but not married; And this is saying: If first sexual intercourse when adultery, by burning; another by strangulation.
llm_translation: What is he saying? Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said: Rabbi Yishmael holds the same opinion as Rabbi, that if a betrothed woman went out for adultery but was not married, she is to be burned. And this is what he is saying: If the initial act of intercourse was through promiscuity - she is to be burned; otherwise - by strangulation.

hebrew_text: מַאי ״וְכֵן״? כִּי הָתָם: מָה הָתָם בִּתְחִילַּת בִּיאָה קָמִשְׁתַּעֵי קְרָא, הָכָא נָמֵי בִּתְחִילַּת בִּיאָה קָמִשְׁתַּעֵי קְרָא.
human_translation: What And likewise like there. Just as there, the verse speaks of first intercourse, here too, the verse speaks of first intercourse.
llm_translation: "What is the meaning of 'and so'? Just as there, at the beginning of creation, the verse comes and reconciles, so too here, at the beginning of creation, the verse comes and reconciles."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב בִּיבִי בַּר אַבָּיֵי: מָר לָא הָכִי אֲמַר. וּמַנּוּ? רַב יוֹסֵף.
human_translation: Rav Beivai bar Abaye said to Master does not say, like that. And who is Rav Yosef.
llm_translation: Rav Bibi bar Abbaye said to him: Master, did not say thus. And who said it? Rav Yosef.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי, כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר סְבִירָא לֵיהּ, דְּאָמַר: נִשֵּׂאת לְאֶחָד מִן הַפְּסוּלִין – מִיתָתָהּ בְּחֶנֶק.
human_translation: Rabbi holds in accordance with Rabbi Meir, who says: married one of the unfit her death by strangulation
llm_translation: Rabbi, like Rabbi Meir, holds the opinion, as he said: "If she is married to one of the disqualified priests - her death is by strangulation."

hebrew_text: וְהָכִי קָאָמַר: אִם תְּחִילַּת אַחָלָתָהּ בִּזְנוּת – בִּשְׂרֵיפָה, וְאִידַּךְ – בְּחֶנֶק. וּמַאי ״וְכֵן״?
human_translation: And this is saying: If she first profanes herself, by adultery, by burning, but another by strangulation. And what And likewise
llm_translation: And thus he said: If the beginning of her misconduct was through promiscuity - by burning, and the other - by strangulation. And what is "and so"?

hebrew_text: סִימָנָא בְּעָלְמָא.
human_translation: merely a mnemonic.
llm_translation: The sign is in the world.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַמֵּסִית – זֶה הֶדְיוֹט, וְהַמֵּסִית אֶת הַהֶדְיוֹט. אָמַר: יֵשׁ יִרְאָה בְּמָקוֹם פְּלוֹנִי, כָּךְ אוֹכֶלֶת, כָּךְ שׁוֹתֶה, כָּךְ מְטִיבָה, כָּךְ מְרֵיעָה.
human_translation: an inciter, this is an ordinary person, And one who incites an ordinary person He says: There is an idol in such and such a place, eats like this, drinks like this, does good like this, harms like this.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: "The tempter - this refers to a commoner, and the tempter tempts the commoner. He says: 'There is fear in such and such a place, eat like this, drink like this, sleep like this, and act kindly like this, and act harshly like this.'"

hebrew_text: כׇּל חַיָּיבֵי מִיתוֹת שֶׁבְּתוֹרָה, אֵין מַכְמִינִין עֲלֵיהֶם, חוּץ מִזּוֹ.
human_translation: all of those in the Torah are liable to the death does not hide to them, except for this
llm_translation: All those liable to death penalties in the Torah, we do not delay their execution except for this case.
