hebrew_text: אָמַר לִשְׁנַיִם: הֵן עֵדָיו, וּמְבִיאִין אוֹתוֹ לְבֵית דִּין וְסוֹקְלִין אוֹתוֹ. אָמַר לְאֶחָד: הוּא אוֹמֵר ״יֵשׁ לִי חֲבֵירִים רוֹצִים בְּכָךְ״.
human_translation: said to two they are his witnesses, and they bring him to court and stone him. he said to one he says I have friends who are interested in this;
llm_translation: He said to two: "Here are his witnesses, and they bring him to the court and stone him." He said to one: "He says, 'I have friends who want this.'"

hebrew_text: אִם הָיָה עָרוּם וְאֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לְדַבֵּר בִּפְנֵיהֶם, מַכְמִינִין לוֹ עֵדִים אֲחוֹרֵי הַגָּדֵר. וְהוּא אוֹמֵר לוֹ: ״אֱמוֹר מַה שֶּׁאָמַרְתָּ בְּיִחוּד!״ וְהַלָּה אוֹמֵר לוֹ. וְהוּא אוֹמֵר לוֹ: ״הֵיאַךְ נַנִּיחַ אֶת אֱלֹהֵינוּ שֶׁבַּשָּׁמַיִם וְנֵלֵךְ וְנַעֲבוֹד עֵצִים וַאֲבָנִים?״ אִם חוֹזֵר בּוֹ – הֲרֵי זֶה מוּטָב, וְאִם אָמַר: ״כָּךְ הִיא חוֹבָתֵנוּ, כָּךְ יָפֶה לָנוּ״ – הָעוֹמְדִין מֵאֲחוֹרֵי הַגָּדֵר מְבִיאִין אוֹתוֹ לְבֵית דִּין וְסוֹקְלִין אוֹתוֹ.
human_translation: If is cunning, and he cannot speak in front of hides witnesses for him behind the fence and says to him: Say what you said in seclusion. And the other says to him And he says to How can we forsake our God in Heaven and go and worship wood and stones? If retracts that is good. But if he says: This is our duty; this suits us, those standing behind the fence bring him to court and have him stoned.
llm_translation: If he was cunning and unable to speak in their presence, they bring witnesses behind the fence. And he says to him: "Say what you said in private!" And the accuser says to him. And he says to him: "How can we forsake our God in heaven and go worship trees and stones?" If he recants - this is better, but if he says: "This is our obligation, this is good for us" - those standing behind the fence bring him to the court and stone him.

hebrew_text: הָאוֹמֵר: ״אֶעֱבוֹד״, ״אֵלֵךְ וְאֶעֱבוֹד״, ״נֵלֵךְ וְנַעֲבוֹד״; ״אֶזְבַּח״, ״אֵלֵךְ וְאֶזְבַּח״, ״נֵלֵךְ וְנִזְבַּח״; ״אַקְטִיר״, ״אֵלֵךְ וְאַקְטִיר״, ״נֵלֵךְ וְנַקְטִיר״; ״אֲנַסֵּךְ״, ״אֵלֵךְ וַאֲנַסֵּךְ״, ״נֵלֵךְ וּנְנַסֵּךְ״; ״אֶשְׁתַּחֲוֶה״, ״אֵלֵךְ וְאֶשְׁתַּחֲוֶה״, ״נֵלֵךְ וְנִשְׁתַּחֲוֶה״.
human_translation: one who says: I shall worship I shall go and worship let us go and worship I shall sacrifice I shall go and sacrifice Let us go and sacrifice I shall burn I shall go and burn Let us go and burn I shall pour I shall go and pour Let us go and pour I shall bow I shall go and bow, Let us go and bow.
llm_translation: The one who says: "I will serve," "I will go and serve," "We will go and serve"; "I will sacrifice," "I will go and sacrifice," "We will go and sacrifice"; "I will burn incense," "I will go and burn incense," "We will go and burn incense"; "I will pour libation," "I will go and pour libation," "We will go and pour libation"; "I will prostrate," "I will go and prostrate," "We will go and prostrate."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ הַמֵּסִית זֶה הֶדְיוֹט. טַעְמָא דְּהֶדְיוֹט, הָא נָבִיא בְּחֶנֶק. וְהַמֵּסִית אֶת הַהֶדְיוֹט, טַעְמָא דְּיָחִיד, הָא רַבִּים בְּחֶנֶק.
human_translation: an inciter, this is an ordinary person. The reason that he is an ordinary person, but a prophet by strangulation, And one who incites an ordinary person. The reason that an individual, but a multitude by strangulation.
llm_translation: Gemara: The one who incites, this is the commoner. The reason for the commoner, as the prophet in strangulation. And the one who incites the commoner, the reason for the individual, as the many in strangulation.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִיתִין מַנִּי? רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן הִיא, דְּתַנְיָא: נָבִיא שֶׁהֵדִיחַ – בִּסְקִילָה. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: בְּחֶנֶק. מַדִּיחֵי עִיר הַנִּדַּחַת – בִּסְקִילָה. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: בְּחֶנֶק.
human_translation: whose the mishna? It is Rabbi Shimon, as it is taught A prophet who subverted by stoning. Rabbi Shimon says: by strangulation. the subverters of an idolatrous city by stoning. Rabbi Shimon says: By strangulation.
llm_translation: Mishnah: Who is the authority? It is Rabbi Shimon, as it was taught: A false prophet - by stoning. Rabbi Shimon says: By strangulation. Those who entice a city to idolatry - by stoning. Rabbi Shimon says: By strangulation.

hebrew_text: אֵימָא סֵיפָא: הַמַּדִּיחַ זֶה הָאוֹמֵר ״נֵלֵךְ וְנַעֲבוֹד עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה״. וְאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: מַדִּיחֵי עִיר הַנִּדַּחַת שָׁנוּ. אֲתָאן לְרַבָּנַן. רֵישָׁא רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן וְסֵיפָא רַבָּנַן?
human_translation: Say the last clause the subverter this is one who says: Let us go and worship idols. And Rav Yehuda says Rav says: taught the subverters of an idolatrous city. we arrive at the Rabbis, the first clause Rabbi Shimon, and the last clause the Rabbis?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Eima seifa: hamadich zeh ha'omer 'nelech vena'abod avodah zarrah'. Ve'amar Rav Yehudah amar Rav: madichei ir hanidachat shanu. Atan le'Rabanan. Reisha Rabbi Shimon ve'seifa Rabanan?" English translation: "Say the latter part: one who entices, this refers to one who says, 'Let us go and serve foreign worship.' And Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: The enticers of the city that has been led astray have changed. They came to the Sages. The beginning, is it Rabbi Shimon and the end, the Sages?"

hebrew_text: רָבִינָא אָמַר: כּוּלָּהּ רַבָּנַן הִיא, וְלָא זוֹ אַף זוֹ קָתָנֵי.
human_translation: Ravina says: The entire is the Rabbis, and teaches Not this also that.
llm_translation: Ravina said: The entirety of it is Rabbinic, and not this one nor that one is Scriptural.

hebrew_text: רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר: כִּי קָתָנֵי ״מֵסִית זֶה הֶדְיוֹט״, לְהַכְמָנָה.
human_translation: Rav Pappa says: When teaches incites this is an ordinary person, to hiding
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: When it is taught "a seducer, this is a layman," for the purpose of comparison.

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: וּשְׁאָר כׇּל חַיָּיבֵי מִיתוֹת שֶׁבַּתּוֹרָה, אֵין מַכְמִינִין עֲלֵיהֶן, חוּץ מִזּוֹ.
human_translation: As it is taught And all the rest of those liable to death by Torah does not hide to them except for this
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: "And all those liable to the death penalty in the Torah, we do not lessen their punishment, except for this one."

hebrew_text: כֵּיצַד עוֹשִׂין לוֹ? מַדְלִיקִין לוֹ אֶת הַנֵּר בַּבַּיִת הַפְּנִימִי, וּמוֹשִׁיבִין לוֹ עֵדִים בַּבַּיִת הַחִיצוֹן, כְּדֵי שֶׁיְּהוּ הֵן רוֹאִין אוֹתוֹ וְשׁוֹמְעִין אֶת קוֹלוֹ, וְהוּא אֵינוֹ רוֹאֶה אוֹתָן. וְהַלָּה אוֹמֵר לוֹ: ״אֱמוֹר מַה שֶּׁאָמַרְתָּ לִי בְּיִחוּד״, וְהוּא אוֹמֵר לוֹ. וְהַלָּה אוֹמֵר לוֹ: ״הֵיאַךְ נַנִּיחַ אֶת אֱלֹהֵינוּ שֶׁבַּשָּׁמַיִם וְנַעֲבוֹד עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה״? אִם חוֹזֵר בּוֹ – מוּטָב, וְאִם אָמַר: ״כָּךְ הִיא חוֹבָתֵנוּ וְכָךְ יָפֶה לָנוּ״ – הָעֵדִים שֶׁשּׁוֹמְעִין מִבַּחוּץ מְבִיאִין אוֹתוֹ לְבֵית דִּין וְסוֹקְלִין אוֹתוֹ.
human_translation: How do to him? light a candle for him in an inner room, and place witnesses for him in an outer room so that they can see him and hear his voice but he cannot see them. And the other says to him: Say what you said to me in seclusion. And he says to him And the other says to him: How can we forsake our God in Heaven and worship idols? If retracts that is good. But if he says: This is our duty, and this suits us, the witnesses, who are listening from outside, bring him to court, and have him stoned.
llm_translation: How do they do it for him? They light the candle for him in the inner room, and they place witnesses for him in the outer room, so that they see him and hear his voice, while he does not see them. And the witness says to him: "Say what you said to me in private," and he says to him. And the witness says to him: "How can we forsake our God in heaven and worship a foreign deity?" If he recants - it is better, but if he says: "This is our obligation and it is good for us" - the witnesses who hear from outside bring him to the court and stone him.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן עָשׂוּ לְבֶן סָטָדָא בְּלוֹד, וּתְלָאוּהוּ בְּעֶרֶב הַפֶּסַח.
human_translation: And did the same to ben Setada, from Lod, and they hanged him on Passover eve.
llm_translation: And so did the sons of Satada in Blod, and they hanged him on the eve of Passover.

hebrew_text: בֶּן סָטָדָא? בֶּן פַּנְדִּירָא הוּא! אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: בַּעַל סָטָדָא, בּוֹעֵל פַּנְדִּירָא. בַּעַל? פַּפּוּס בֶּן יְהוּדָה הוּא! אֶלָּא, אִמּוֹ סָטָדָא. אִמּוֹ? מִרְיָם מְגַדְּלָא נְשַׁיָּא הֲוַאי! כִּדְאָמְרִי בְּפוּמְבְּדִיתָא: ״סְטָת דָּא מִבַּעְלַהּ״.
human_translation: ben Setada, he was the son of Pandeira? Rav Ḥisda says: husband, Setada, paramour, Pandeira. husband was Pappos ben Yehuda, Rather, his mother Setada, his mother was Miriam, who braided women’s hair. as they say in Pumbedita: This one strayed [ setat da ] from her husband.
llm_translation: Son of Satada? He is the son of Pandira! Rav Hisda said: The husband of Satada, he impregnated Pandira. Husband? Pappus son of Judah he is! Rather, his mother is Satada. His mother? Miriam the hairdresser was his wife! As it is said in Pumbedita: "This one is from her husband."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַמַּדִּיחַ – זֶה הָאוֹמֵר: ״נֵלֵךְ וְנַעֲבוֹד עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה״.
human_translation: the subverter this is one who says Let us go and worship idols.
llm_translation: Mishnah: One who entices to idolatry - this is one who says, "Let us go and serve foreign worship."

hebrew_text: הַמְכַשֵּׁף – הָעוֹשֶׂה מַעֲשֶׂה חַיָּיב, וְלֹא הָאוֹחֵז אֶת הָעֵינַיִם. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: שְׁנַיִם לוֹקְטִין קִשּׁוּאִין, אֶחָד לוֹקֵט פָּטוּר וְאֶחָד לוֹקֵט חַיָּיב. הָעוֹשֶׂה מַעֲשֶׂה חַיָּיב, הָאוֹחֵז אֶת הָעֵינַיִם פָּטוּר.
human_translation: The warlock One who performs act is liable, but not one who deceives the eyes, Rabbi Akiva says in the name of Rabbi Yehoshua: two gather cucumbers One gathers exempt, and one gathers liable. The one who performs act liable, the one who deceives the eyes is exempt.
llm_translation: The one who practices sorcery - one who performs an action is liable, but not one who merely holds the eyes. Rabbi Akiva says in the name of Rabbi Yehoshua: Two gather bundles of straw, one who gathers is exempt and one who gathers is liable. One who performs an action is liable, one who holds the eyes is exempt.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: מַדִּיחֵי עִיר הַנִּדַּחַת שָׁנוּ כָּאן.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Rav says: taught here the subverters of an idolatrous city.
llm_translation: Gemara: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: The elders of the city of the banished have taught here.

hebrew_text: הַמְכַשֵּׁף – זֶה הָעוֹשֶׂה מַעֲשֶׂה וְכוּ׳. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״מְכַשֵּׁפָה״ – אֶחָד הָאִישׁ וְאֶחָד הָאִשָּׁה. אִם כֵּן, מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״מְכַשֵּׁפָה״? מִפְּנֵי שֶׁרוֹב נָשִׁים מְצוּיוֹת בִּכְשָׁפִים.
human_translation: the warlock is one who performs act The Sages taught “You shall not allow a witch to live” both a man and a woman If so, why verse state “a witch”? because most women are familiar with witchcraft.
llm_translation: The one who practices sorcery - this is one who performs the act, etc. The sages taught: "Sorceress" - whether a man or a woman. If so, what is the Talmud coming to say "sorceress"? Because most women are found in sorcery.

hebrew_text: מִיתָתָן בַּמֶּה? רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי אוֹמֵר: נֶאֱמַר כָּאן ״מְכַשֵּׁפָה לֹא תְחַיֶּה״, וְנֶאֱמַר לְהַלָּן ״לֹא תְחַיֶּה כׇּל נְשָׁמָה״. מָה לְהַלָּן בְּסַיִיף, אַף כָּאן בְּסַיִיף.
human_translation: In what their death Rabbi Yosei HaGelili says: It is stated here: “You shall not allow a witch to live,” and it is stated there, “You shall allow nothing that breathes to live” Just as there, by sword so too here, by sword.
llm_translation: The death penalty by what? Rabbi Yosei the Galilean says: It is stated here "You shall not allow a sorceress to live," and it is stated there "You shall not allow any soul to live." Just as there, by the sword, so too here, by the sword.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: נֶאֱמַר כָּאן ״מְכַשֵּׁפָה לֹא תְחַיֶּה״, וְנֶאֱמַר לְהַלָּן ״אִם בְּהֵמָה אִם אִישׁ לֹא יִחְיֶה״. מָה לְהַלָּן בִּסְקִילָה, אַף כָּאן בִּסְקִילָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: It is stated here: “You shall not allow a witch to live,” and it is stated there, whether it be animal or man, it shall not live” Just as there, of stoning, so too here, by stoning.
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: It is stated here "A sorceress shall not live," and it is stated there "Whether it be beast or man, they shall not live." Just as there, it is by stoning, so too here, it is by stoning.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: אֲנִי דַּנְתִּי ״לֹא תְחַיֶּה״ מִ״לֹּא תְחַיֶּה״, וְאַתָּה דַּנְתָּ ״לֹא תְחַיֶּה״ מִ״לֹּא יִחְיֶה״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei said to him: I derived “You shall not allow to live” from “You shall allow nothing to live” but you derived “You shall not allow to live” from “It shall not live,”
llm_translation: He said to him Rabbi Yosei: I interpreted "you shall not live" from "you shall not live," and you interpreted "you shall not live" from "he shall not live."

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: אֲנִי דַּנְתִּי יִשְׂרָאֵל מִיִּשְׂרָאֵל, שֶׁרִיבָּה בָּהֶן הַכָּתוּב מִיתוֹת הַרְבֵּה, וְאַתָּה דַּנְתָּ יִשְׂרָאֵל מִגּוֹיִם, שֶׁלֹּא רִיבָּה בָּהֶן הַכָּתוּב אֶלָּא
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva said to him: I derived Jews from Jews, with regard to whom the verse included many death But you derived Jews from gentiles, with regard to whom the verse included only
llm_translation: He said to him Rabbi Akiva: I judged Israel from Israel, for the Scripture included in them many deaths, and you judged Israel from the nations, for the Scripture included in them only

hebrew_text: מִיתָה אַחַת.
human_translation: one death
llm_translation: Death one.

hebrew_text: בֶּן עַזַּאי אוֹמֵר: נֶאֱמַר ״מְכַשֵּׁפָה לֹא תְחַיֶּה״, וְנֶאֱמַר ״כׇּל שֹׁכֵב עִם בְּהֵמָה מוֹת יוּמָת״. סְמָכוֹ עִנְיָן לוֹ, מָה שׁוֹכֵב עִם בְּהֵמָה בִּסְקִילָה – אַף מְכַשֵּׁף בִּסְקִילָה.
human_translation: Ben Azzai says it is stated: “You shall not allow a witch to live” and it is stated “Whoever lies with an animal shall be put to death” juxtaposes this matter to that to just as lies with an animal by stoning so too, a warlock by stoning.
llm_translation: Ben Azzai says: It is stated, "A witch shall not live," and it is stated, "Whoever lies with an animal shall surely be put to death." He derived an analogy: Just as one who lies with an animal is punished by stoning, so too a witch is punished by stoning.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: וְכִי מִפְּנֵי שֶׁסְּמָכוֹ עִנְיָן לוֹ, נוֹצִיא לָזֶה בִּסְקִילָה? אֶלָּא, אוֹב וְיִדְּעוֹנִי בִּכְלַל מְכַשְּׁפִים הָיוּ, וְלָמָּה יָצְאוּ? לְהַקִּישׁ עֲלֵיהֶן וְלוֹמַר לָךְ: מָה אוֹב וְיִדְּעוֹנִי בִּסְקִילָה – אַף מְכַשֵּׁף בִּסְקִילָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda said to him: And because juxtaposes this matter with that shall we take this out to be stoned? Rather, A necromancer and a sorcerer were in the category of warlocks, and why were they singled out to draw an analogy to them and say to you: Just as a necromancer and a sorcerer by stoning, so too, a warlock by stoning.
llm_translation: He said to him Rabbi Yehuda: And because he relied on this matter, shall we bring him out to be stoned? Rather, Ov and Yidoni were included among sorcerers, and why did they go out? To draw a comparison with them and say to you: Just as Ov and Yidoni are stoned, so too a sorcerer is stoned.

hebrew_text: לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה נָמֵי, לִיהְווֹ אוֹב וְיִדְּעוֹנִי שְׁנֵי כְתוּבִים הַבָּאִים כְּאֶחָד, וְכׇל שְׁנֵי כְתוּבִין הַבָּאִין כְּאֶחָד אֵין מְלַמְּדִין!
human_translation: According to Rabbi Yehuda as well, let a necromancer and a sorcerer be two verses that come as one, and any two verses that come as one do not teach
llm_translation: To Rabbi Yehuda Nami, let there be a necromancer and a knowing one, two Scriptures that come as one, and any two Scriptures that come as one do not teach!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי זְכַרְיָה: עֲדָא אָמְרָה, קָסָבַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: שְׁנֵי כְתוּבִין הַבָּאִין כְּאֶחָד מְלַמְּדִין.
human_translation: Rabbi Zekharya says: This means Rabbi Yehuda holds two verses that come as one do teach
llm_translation: Rabbi Zechariah said: Ada said, Rabbi Yehuda holds: Two Scriptures that come as one teach.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: לָמָּה נִקְרָא שְׁמָן כְּשָׁפִים? שֶׁמַּכְחִישִׁין פָּמַלְיָא שֶׁל מַעְלָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Why called keshafim ? Because Contradicts the heavenly entourage [ shemakhḥishin pamalia shel mala ].
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yochanan: Why is it called "shemen" (oil)? Because it nullifies the decree of the Heavenly Court.

hebrew_text: ״אֵין עוֹד מִלְבַדּוֹ״, אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: אֲפִילּוּ לִדְבַר כְּשָׁפִים.
human_translation: there is none else besides Him” Rabbi Ḥanina says: even to a matter of sorcery;
llm_translation: "There is none besides Him," said Rabbi Chanina: Even for a matter of sorcery.

hebrew_text: הָהִיא אִיתְּתָא דַּהֲוָת קָא מְהַדְּרָא לְמִשְׁקַל עַפְרָא מִתּוּתֵי כַּרְעֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא. אֲמַר לַהּ: אִי מִסְתַּיַּיעְתְּ, זִילִי עֲבִידִי. ״אֵין עוֹד מִלְבַדּוֹ״ כְּתִיב.
human_translation: a certain woman who was attempting to take dust from under the feet of Rabbi Ḥanina said to her: If you succeed, go do it is written: “There is none else besides Him.”
llm_translation: That woman, who was combing the hair of the daughter of Rabbi Chanina, said to her: "If you are successful, go and do." "There is none besides Him" is written.

hebrew_text: אִינִי? וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: לָמָּה נִקְרָא שְׁמָן מְכַשְּׁפִים? שֶׁמַּכְחִישִׁין פָּמַלְיָא שֶׁל מַעְלָה. שָׁאנֵי רַבִּי חֲנִינָא, דִּנְפִישׁ זְכוּתֵיהּ.
human_translation: Is that so? But doesn’t Rabbi Yoḥanan say: Why called mekhashefim ? Because Contradicts the heavenly entourage. Rabbi Ḥanina is different, as his merit is great,
llm_translation: I am? And didn't Rabbi Yochanan say: Why is it called the oil of witches? Because it nullifies the decree of the Heavenly Court. This is different from Rabbi Chanina, whose merits are great.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אַיְיבוּ בַּר נַגָּרֵי אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא: ״בְּלָטֵיהֶם״ – אֵלּוּ מַעֲשֵׂה שֵׁדִים, ״בְּלַהֲטֵיהֶם״ – אֵלּוּ מַעֲשֵׂה כְשָׁפִים. וְכֵן הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״וְאֵת לַהַט הַחֶרֶב הַמִּתְהַפֶּכֶת״.
human_translation: Rabbi Aivu bar Nagri says Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba says with their secret arts [ belateihem ]” these are acts of demons, “ belahateihem ” these are acts of sorcery, And likewise it says: “And the flaming [ lahat ] sword that turned every way”
llm_translation: Rabbi Ayyivu son of Naggarai said Rabbi Hiyya son of Abba said: "Their wiles" - these are the deeds of demons, "their flames" - these are the deeds of sorcerers. And so it says: "And the flame of the revolving sword."

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: דְּקָפֵיד אַמָּנָא – שֵׁד, דְּלָא קָפֵיד אַמָּנָא – כְּשָׁפִים.
human_translation: Abaye says: who is particular about utensil a demon; who is not particular about utensil sorcery.
llm_translation: Abbaye said: One who is meticulous with faith - is a demon, one who is not meticulous with faith - is a sorcerer.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: הִלְכוֹת כְּשָׁפִים כְּהִלְכוֹת שַׁבָּת, יֵשׁ מֵהֶן בִּסְקִילָה, וְיֵשׁ מֵהֶן פָּטוּר אֲבָל אָסוּר, וְיֵשׁ מֵהֶן מוּתָּר לְכַתְּחִלָּה.
human_translation: Abaye says: The halakhot of sorcery are like the halakhot of Shabbat, There are of them by stoning, and there are of them exempt but prohibited and there are of them permitted ab initio .
llm_translation: Abaye said: The laws of sorcery are like the laws of Shabbat. Some of them are punishable by stoning, and some of them are exempt but forbidden, and some of them are permitted initially.

hebrew_text: הָעוֹשֶׂה מַעֲשֶׂה – בִּסְקִילָה, הָאוֹחֵז אֶת הָעֵינַיִם – פָּטוּר אֲבָל אָסוּר. מוּתָּר לְכַתְּחִלָּה – כִּדְרַב חֲנִינָא וְרַב אוֹשַׁעְיָא: כׇּל מַעֲלֵי שַׁבְּתָא הֲווֹ עָסְקִי בְּהִלְכוֹת יְצִירָה, וּמִיבְּרֵי לְהוּ עִיגְלָא תִּילְתָּא, וְאָכְלִי לֵיהּ.
human_translation: One who performs act by stoning. One who deceives the eyes is exempt but prohibited permitted ab initio like Rav Ḥanina and Rav Oshaya: Every Shabbat eve they would engage in the halakhot of creation, and a third-born calf would be created for them, and they would eat it
llm_translation: One who performs an action - with stoning, one who grasps the eyes - exempt but forbidden. Permitted initially - as Rav Chanina and Rav Oshaya: All those who ascend the Sabbath were engaged in the laws of formation, and they would bring him a third-grown calf, and they would eat it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: חֲזֵינָא לֵיהּ לַאֲבוּהּ דְּקַרְנָא, דְּנָפֵיץ וְשָׁדֵי כְּרִיכֵי דְשִׁירָאֵי מִנְּחִירֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: I saw Karna’s father which he would blow and cast rolls of silk from his nostrils
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said: I saw the father of the horn, who scattered and threw the crowns of the songs from his horns.

hebrew_text: ״וַיֹּאמְרוּ הַחַרְטֻמִּם אֶל פַּרְעֹה אֶצְבַּע אֱלֹהִים הִיא״. אָמַר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: מִיכָּן שֶׁאֵין הַשֵּׁד יָכוֹל לִבְראוֹת בְּרִיָּה פָּחוֹת מִכִּשְׂעוֹרָה.
human_translation: “And the magicians said to Pharaoh: This is the finger of God” Rabbi Eliezer says: from here that a demon cannot create an entity smaller than a barley grain.
llm_translation: "And the magicians said to Pharaoh, 'It is the finger of God.'" Rabbi Eliezer said: From here we learn that a demon cannot create a creature smaller than a barleycorn.

hebrew_text: רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר: הָאֱלֹהִים! אֲפִילּוּ כְּגַמְלָא נָמֵי לָא מָצֵי בָּרֵי. הַאי מִיכְּנִיף לֵיהּ, וְהַאי לָא מִיכְּנִיף לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: By God! They cannot create even as a camel. they can gather these but they cannot gather those
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: "God! Even like a camel, it cannot be found a creator. This one bows to it, and this one does not bow to it."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב לְרַבִּי חִיָּיא: לְדִידִי חֲזֵי לִי הַהוּא טַיָּיעָא, דְּשַׁקְלֵיהּ לְסַפְסִירָא וְגַיְּידֵיהּ לְגַמְלֵאּ, וּטְרַף לֵיהּ בְּטַבְלָא, וְקָם. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לְבָתַר הָכִי, דָּם וּפַרְתָּא מִי הֲוַאי? אֶלָּא, הַהִיא אֲחִיזַת עֵינַיִם הֲוָה.
human_translation: Rav said to Rabbi Ḥiyya: I myself saw a certain Arab who took a sword and sliced a camel and beat a drum [ betavla ], and arose said to him: Was there blood and excretion afterward Rather, that was a deception of the eyes
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav to Rabbi Chiya: According to my opinion, that barrel was seen by me, which he took to the wine cellar and brought out to the camel, and he tore it with a knife, and it stood up. He said to him: After this, was it blood and a cow? Rather, that was an optical illusion.

hebrew_text: זְעֵירִי אִיקְּלַע לַאֲלֶכְּסַנְדְּרִיָּא שֶׁל מִצְרַיִם. זְבַן חַמְרָא. כִּי מְטָא לְאַשְׁקוֹיֵיהּ מַיָּא, פְּשַׁר וְקָם גַּמְלָא דְּאוּסְקָנִיתָא. אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: אִי לָאו זְעֵירִי אַתְּ, לָא הֲוָה מַהְדְּרִינַן לָךְ. מִי אִיכָּא דְּזָבֵין מִידֵּי הָכָא וְלָא בָּדֵיק לֵיהּ אַמַּיָּא?
human_translation: Ze’eiri happened to Alexandria of Egypt. He bought a donkey. When he was about to give it to drink thawed and it turned into the plank of a bridge. said to him: If you were not Ze’eiri, we would not refund you Is there who buys an item here and does not examine it with water?
llm_translation: Zeri entered the Alexandrian bathhouse. He bought wine. When he came to drink water, he poured and a camel of fine silk arose. They said to him: If you are not Zeri, we would not honor you. Is there anyone who buys from here and does not check the price?

hebrew_text: יַנַּאי אִיקְּלַע לְהָהוּא אוּשְׁפִּיזָא. אֲמַר לְהוּ: אַשְׁקְיַן מַיָּא. קָרִיבוּ שְׁתִיתָא. חֲזָא דְּקָא מְרַחֲשָׁן שִׂפְוָותַהּ, שְׁדָא פּוּרְתָּא מִינֵּיהּ. הֲווֹ עַקְרַבֵּי. אֲמַר לְהוּ: אֲנָא שְׁתַאי מִדִּידְכוּ, אַתּוּן נָמֵי שְׁתוֹ מִדִּידִי. אַשְׁקְיַיהּ, הֲוַאי חַמְרָא. רַכְבַהּ, סָלֵיק לְשׁוּקָא. אֲתָא חֲבֶרְתָּהּ, פְּשַׁרָה לַהּ. חַזְיֵיהּ דְּרָכֵיב וְקָאֵי אַאִיתְּתָא בְּשׁוּקָא.
human_translation: Yannai arrived at a certain inn. He said to Give me water to drink. They brought flour mixed with water. He saw that the lips of were moving, cast a bit of turned into scorpions, said to them: I drank from yours; you too drink from mine, He gave her to drink she turned into a donkey. He rode upon her went to the marketplace. Her friend came released her and saw him riding on a woman in the marketplace.
llm_translation: Yannai encountered that witch. He said to them: "Give me water." They brought him a drink. He saw that she was rubbing her lips, a drop of wine from them. He was suspicious. He said to them: "I will drink from yours, you also drink from mine." He drank, it was vinegar. He left for the market. Her friend came, she explained to her. He saw that he rode and stood with a witch in the market.

hebrew_text: ״וַתַּעַל הַצְּפַרְדֵּעַ וַתְּכַס אֶת אֶרֶץ מִצְרָיִם״. אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: צְפַרְדֵּעַ אַחַת הָיְתָה, הִשְׁרִיצָה וּמִלְּאָה כׇּל אֶרֶץ מִצְרַיִם.
human_translation: “And the frog came up and covered the land of Egypt” Rabbi Elazar says: it was one frog; it spawned and filled the entire land of Egypt
llm_translation: "And the frog went up and covered the land of Egypt." Rabbi Elazar said: There was one frog, it emitted and filled the entire land of Egypt."

hebrew_text: כְּתַנָּאֵי: רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר, צְפַרְדֵּעַ אַחַת הָיְתָה וּמִלְּאָה כׇּל אֶרֶץ מִצְרַיִם. אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה: עֲקִיבָא, מָה לְךָ אֵצֶל הַגָּדָה? כַּלֵּה מִדַּבְּרוֹתֶיךָ וְלֵךְ אֵצֶל נְגָעִים וְאֹהָלוֹת. צְפַרְדֵּעַ אַחַת הָיְתָה, שָׁרְקָה לָהֶם וְהֵם בָּאוּ.
human_translation: subject to tanna’im : Rabbi Akiva says: It was one frog, and it filled the entire land of Egypt Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya said to him: Akiva, what are you doing with aggada ? Take your statements to Nega’im and Oholot . It was one frog; it whistled to and they came
llm_translation: Tannaite: Rabbi Akiva says, "There was one frog, and it filled the entire land of Egypt." Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah said to him, "Akiva, what do you have to do with the Haggadah? Cease from your words and go to plagues and tents." There was one frog, it croaked and they came.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא כּוּ׳.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva says
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Akiva: "Thus."

hebrew_text: וְהָא רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא מֵרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ גְּמִיר לַהּ? וְהָתַנְיָא: כְּשֶׁחָלָה רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, נִכְנְסוּ רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא וַחֲבֵירָיו לְבַקְּרוֹ. הוּא יוֹשֵׁב בְּקִינוֹף שֶׁלּוֹ, וְהֵן יוֹשְׁבִין בִּטְרַקְלִין שֶׁלּוֹ.
human_translation: And did Rabbi Akiva learn from Rabbi Yehoshua? But isn’t it taught When Rabbi Eliezer took ill, Rabbi Akiva and his colleagues came to visit him. He was sitting on his canopied bed [ bekinof ], and they were sitting in his parlor [ biteraklin ];
llm_translation: And this, Rabbi Akiva from Rabbi Yehoshua learned it? And it was taught: When Rabbi Eliezer fell ill, Rabbi Akiva and his colleagues entered to visit him. He was sitting on his bed, and they were sitting on chairs.

hebrew_text: וְאוֹתוֹ הַיּוֹם עֶרֶב שַׁבָּת הָיָה, וְנִכְנַס הוּרְקָנוֹס בְּנוֹ לַחְלוֹץ תְּפִלָּיו. גָּעַר בּוֹ וְיָצָא בִּנְזִיפָה. אָמַר לָהֶן לַחֲבֵירָיו: כִּמְדוּמֶּה אֲנִי שֶׁדַּעְתּוֹ שֶׁל אַבָּא נִטְרְפָה. אָמַר לָהֶן: דַּעְתּוֹ וְדַעַת אִמּוֹ נִטְרְפָה! הֵיאַךְ מַנִּיחִין אִיסּוּר סְקִילָה וְעוֹסְקִין בְּאִיסּוּר שְׁבוּת?
human_translation: And that day was Shabbat eve, and son Hyrcanus entered to remove his phylacteries, berated him, and he left reprimanded. said to his colleagues: It appears to me that father went insane, said to them: He, and his mother went insane. How can they neglect prohibitions stoning, and engage in prohibitions by rabbinic decree,
llm_translation: And that day was erev Shabbat, and Hurkanos entered to remove his tefillin from his son. He rebuked him and he left with a slap. He said to his colleagues: "I am like a mute person, for I know that the mind of his father has become deranged." He said to them: "His mind and the mind of his mother have become deranged! How can we leave the prohibition of stoning and engage in the prohibition of carrying on Shabbat?"

hebrew_text: כֵּיוָן שֶׁרָאוּ חֲכָמִים שֶׁדַּעְתּוֹ מְיוּשֶּׁבֶת עָלָיו, נִכְנְסוּ וְיָשְׁבוּ לְפָנָיו מֵרָחוֹק אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת.
human_translation: Since the Sages perceived that his mind was stable, they entered and sat before him at a distance of four cubits,
llm_translation: Once the sages saw that his knowledge was settled upon him, they entered and sat before him from a distance of four cubits.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָהֶם: לָמָּה בָּאתֶם? אָמְרוּ לוֹ: לִלְמוֹד תּוֹרָה בָּאנוּ. אָמַר לָהֶם: וְעַד עַכְשָׁיו לָמָּה לֹא בָּאתֶם? אָמְרוּ לוֹ: לֹא הָיָה לָנוּ פְּנַאי. אָמַר לָהֶן: תָּמֵיהַּ אֲנִי אִם יָמוּתוּ מִיתַת עַצְמָן. אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: שֶׁלִּי מַהוּ? אָמַר לוֹ: שֶׁלְּךָ קָשָׁה מִשֶּׁלָּהֶן.
human_translation: said to them: Why have you come? They said to him: We have come to study Torah, said to them: And why have you not come until now? They said to him: We did not have spare time. said to them: I would be surprised if these die their own death, Rabbi Akiva said to him: How will my said to him: Your worse than theirs,
llm_translation: He said to them: Why have you come? They said to him: We have come to study Torah. He said to them: And until now, why have you not come? They said to him: We did not have free time. He said to them: I am amazed if they die a natural death. Rabbi Akiva said to him: What about me? He said to him: Yours is more severe than theirs.

hebrew_text: נָטַל שְׁתֵּי זְרוֹעוֹתָיו וְהִנִּיחָן עַל לִבּוֹ, אָמַר: אוֹי לָכֶם שְׁתֵּי זְרוֹעוֹתַיי, שֶׁהֵן כִּשְׁתֵּי סִפְרֵי תוֹרָה שֶׁנִּגְלָלִין! הַרְבֵּה תּוֹרָה לָמַדְתִּי, וְהַרְבֵּה תּוֹרָה לִימַּדְתִּי. הַרְבֵּה תּוֹרָה לָמַדְתִּי, וְלֹא חִסַּרְתִּי מֵרַבּוֹתַי אֲפִילּוּ כַּכֶּלֶב הַמְּלַקֵּק מִן הַיָּם. הַרְבֵּה תּוֹרָה לִימַּדְתִּי, וְלֹא חִסְּרוּנִי תַּלְמִידַי אֶלָּא כְּמִכְחוֹל בִּשְׁפוֹפֶרֶת.
human_translation: raised his two arms and placed them on his heart, said: Woe to you, my two arms, as they are like two Torah scrolls that are being rolled up, I have learned much Torah, and I have taught much Torah. I have learned much Torah, and I have not taken away from my teachers, even like a dog lapping from the sea. I have taught much Torah, and my students have taken away from me, only like a paintbrush from a tube
llm_translation: He took his two arms and placed them on his heart, saying: "Woe to you, my two arms, for they are like two Torah scrolls that have been rolled up! I have learned much Torah, and I have taught much Torah. I have learned much Torah, and I have not lacked from my teachers even as the dog that licks from the sea. I have taught much Torah, and my students have not diminished me, but are like a needle in a sieve."

hebrew_text: וְלֹא עוֹד, אֶלָּא שֶׁאֲנִי שׁוֹנֶה שְׁלֹשׁ מֵאוֹת הֲלָכוֹת בְּבַהֶרֶת עַזָּה, וְלֹא הָיָה אָדָם שׁוֹאֲלֵנִי בָּהֶן דָּבָר מֵעוֹלָם. וְלֹא עוֹד, אֶלָּא שֶׁאֲנִי שׁוֹנֶה שְׁלֹשׁ מֵאוֹת הֲלָכוֹת, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ: שְׁלֹשֶׁת אֲלָפִים הֲלָכוֹת, בִּנְטִיעַת קִשּׁוּאִין, וְלֹא הָיָה אָדָם שׁוֹאֲלֵנִי בָּהֶן דָּבָר מֵעוֹלָם, חוּץ מֵעֲקִיבָא בֶּן יוֹסֵף.
human_translation: Moreover, I can teach three hundred halakhot with regard to a snow-white leprous mark [ bebaheret ], but no person has ever asked me anything about them. Moreover, I can teach three hundred halakhot , and some say three thousand halakhot , with regard to the planting of cucumbers but no person has ever asked me anything about them, besides Akiva ben Yosef.
llm_translation: And not only that, but I have reviewed three hundred laws in the sharp mountain, and no one has ever asked me about them. And not only that, but I have reviewed three hundred laws, and they say: three thousand laws, regarding the planting of cucumbers, and no one has ever asked me about them, except for Akiva ben Yosef.

hebrew_text: פַּעַם אַחַת אֲנִי וָהוּא מְהַלְּכִין הָיִינוּ בַּדֶּרֶךְ, אָמַר לִי: רַבִּי, לַמְּדֵנִי בִּנְטִיעַת קִשּׁוּאִין. אָמַרְתִּי דָּבָר אֶחָד, נִתְמַלְּאָה כׇּל הַשָּׂדֶה קִשּׁוּאִין. אֲמַר לִי: רַבִּי, לִמַּדְתַּנִי נְטִיעָתָן, לַמְּדֵנִי עֲקִירָתָן. אָמַרְתִּי דָּבָר אֶחָד, נִתְקַבְּצוּ כּוּלָּן לְמָקוֹם אֶחָד.
human_translation: Once he and I were walking along the way, he said to me: My teacher, teach me about the planting of cucumbers. I said one statement the entire field became filled with cucumbers. He said to me: My teacher, you have taught me planting them; teach me uprooting them. I said one statement and they all were gathered to one place.
llm_translation: Once, I and he were walking on the road, he said to me: Rabbi, teach me about planting cucumbers. I said one thing, the whole field was filled with cucumbers. He said to me: Rabbi, you taught me about their planting, teach me about uprooting them. I said one thing, they all gathered to one place.

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ לוֹ: הַכַּדּוּר וְהָאִמּוּם וְהַקָּמֵיעַ וּצְרוֹר הַמַּרְגָּלִיּוֹת וּמִשְׁקוֹלֶת קְטַנָּה, מַהוּ? אָמַר לָהֶן: הֵן טְמֵאִין, וְטַהֲרָתָן בְּמָה שֶׁהֵן.
human_translation: asked him What is a ball and a last, and an amulet and a pouch for pearls, and a small weight, said to them: They are susceptible to impurity, and their purification is as they are,
llm_translation: They said to him: The pot, the blemish, the fork, the bundle of stalks, and a small weight, what is the ruling? He said to them: They are unclean, and their purification is with what they are.

hebrew_text: מִנְעָל שֶׁעַל גַּבֵּי הָאִמּוּם, מַהוּ? אָמַר לָהֶן: הוּא טָהוֹר, וְיָצְאָה נִשְׁמָתוֹ בְּטׇהֳרָה. עָמַד רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ עַל רַגְלָיו וְאָמַר: הוּתַּר הַנֶּדֶר, הוּתַּר הַנֶּדֶר!
human_translation: What is a shoe that is on a last? said to them: It is pure, and his soul left in purity. Rabbi Yehoshua stood on his feet and said: The vow is permitted; the vow is permitted;
llm_translation: Shoe that is on top of the blemish, what? He said to them: It is pure, and his soul departed in purity. Rabbi Yehoshua stood on his feet and said: The vow is annulled, the vow is annulled!

hebrew_text: לְמוֹצָאֵי שַׁבָּת פָּגַע בּוֹ רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא בֵּין קֵסָרִי לְלוֹד. הָיָה מַכֶּה בִּבְשָׂרוֹ עַד שֶׁדָּמוֹ שׁוֹתֵת לָאָרֶץ. פָּתַח עָלָיו בְּשׁוּרָה וְאָמַר: אָבִי אָבִי רֶכֶב יִשְׂרָאֵל וּפָרָשָׁיו. הַרְבֵּה מָעוֹת יֵשׁ לִי וְאֵין לִי שׁוּלְחָנִי לְהַרְצוֹתָן.
human_translation: At the conclusion of Shabbat, Rabbi Akiva encountered from Caesarea to Lod. was striking his flesh until his blood flowed to the earth. He began to in the row and said: “My father, my father, the chariot of Israel and its horsemen” I have many coins, but I do not have a money changer to give them,
llm_translation: On the eve of Shabbat, Rabbi Akiva encountered between Kesari and Lod. He was striking his flesh until his blood flowed to the ground. He opened with a parable and said: "My father, my father, the chariot of Israel and its horsemen. I have much money, but I have no table to satisfy them."

hebrew_text: אַלְמָא, מֵרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר גַּמְרַהּ? גַּמְרַהּ מֵרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר וְלָא סַבְרַהּ. הֲדַר גַּמְרַהּ מֵרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ, וְאַסְבְּרַהּ נִיהֲלֵיהּ.
human_translation: Apparently, learned from Rabbi Eliezer, He learned it from Rabbi Eliezer but he did not understand it. Later he learned it from Rabbi Yehoshua, and explained it to him.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates to: "Is it that Rabbi Eliezer concluded? He concluded from Rabbi Eliezer but did not agree. He then concluded from Rabbi Yehoshua, and she agreed with him."

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי עָבֵיד הָכִי? וְהָאֲנַן תְּנַן: הָעוֹשֶׂה מַעֲשֶׂה – חַיָּיב! לְהִתְלַמֵּד שָׁאנֵי, דְּאָמַר מָר: ״לֹא תִלְמַד לַעֲשׂוֹת״ – לַעֲשׂוֹת אִי אַתָּה לָמֵד, אֲבָל אַתָּה לָמֵד לְהָבִין וּלְהוֹרוֹת.
human_translation: How could have performed that But didn’t we learn one who performs an act is liable? to teach oneself is different, as the Master says “You shall not learn to do you shall not learn, to do, but you may learn, to understand and teach
llm_translation: How does one do so? And we learned: One who performs an action - is liable! To learn, for it was stated by the Master: "Do not learn to do" - to do, you shall not learn, but you shall learn to understand and to teach.

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ אַרְבַּע מִיתוֹת
llm_translation: We will return to you with four deaths.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ בֵּן סוֹרֵר וּמוֹרֶה, מֵאֵימָתַי נַעֲשֶׂה בֵּן סוֹרֵר וּמוֹרֶה?
human_translation: From when does a stubborn and rebellious son become a stubborn and rebellious son?
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: "A rebellious son and a rebellious teacher, from when do they become a rebellious son and a rebellious teacher?"

hebrew_text: מִשֶּׁיָּבִיא שְׁתֵּי שְׂעָרוֹת, וְעַד שֶׁיַּקִּיף זָקָן הַתַּחְתּוֹן וְלֹא הָעֶלְיוֹן, אֶלָּא שֶׁדִּבְּרוּ חֲכָמִים בִּלְשׁוֹן נְקִיָּה. שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי יִהְיֶה לְאִישׁ בֵּן״ – בֵּן וְלֹא בַּת, בֵּן וְלֹא אִישׁ. קָטָן פָּטוּר, שֶׁלֹּא בָּא לִכְלַל מִצְוֹת.
human_translation: From when he grows two hairs, until he has grown a beard around. the lower and not the upper but the Sages spoke in euphemistic terms. As it is stated: “If a man has son” a son, but not a daughter; a son, but not man. A minor exempt because he has not reached inclusion in mitzvot.
llm_translation: When he brings two hairs, and until he encircles the lower beard but not the upper, except that the sages spoke in a clean language. As it is stated: "If a man has a son" - a son and not a daughter, a son and not a man. A minor is exempt, as he has not come to include in the commandments.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ קָטָן מְנָלַן דְּפָטוּר? מְנָלַן?! כִּדְקָתָנֵי טַעְמָא: שֶׁלֹּא בָּא לִכְלַל מִצְוֹת! וְתוּ, הֵיכָא אַשְׁכְּחַן דְּעָנַשׁ הַכָּתוּב, דְּהָכָא לִיבְעֵי קְרָא לְמִיפְטְרֵיהּ?
human_translation: From where do we that a minor exempt From where do we The reason as is taught Because he has not reached inclusion in mitzvot. And furthermore, where do we find that the verse punishes so that verse should be required here to exempt him?
llm_translation: Gemara: A minor - from where do we derive that he is exempt? From where?! As it is taught in the reasoning: that he is not included in the commandments! And furthermore, where do we find that the Scripture penalizes here, that a verse is needed to exempt him?

hebrew_text: אֲנַן הָכִי קָאָמְרִינַן: אַטּוּ בֵּן סוֹרֵר וּמוֹרֶה עַל חֶטְאוֹ נֶהֱרָג? עַל שֵׁם סוֹפוֹ נֶהֱרָג! וְכֵיוָן דְּעַל שֵׁם סוֹפוֹ נֶהֱרָג, אֲפִילּוּ קָטָן נָמֵי? וְעוֹד, ״בֵּן״ וְלֹא אִישׁ – קָטָן מַשְׁמַע!
human_translation: This we are saying: Is this to say a stubborn and rebellious son is killed for a sin he is killed for what in the end. And since he is executed for what he will in the end, even a minor as well And furthermore, “A son,” but not a man, indicates a minor
llm_translation: We thus say: Is it so that a rebellious son and a teacher of transgression are put to death for his sin? For his end he is put to death! And since for his end he is put to death, even if he is a minor? Furthermore, "son" and not "man" - implies a minor!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: דְּאָמַר קְרָא, ״וְכִי יִהְיֶה לְאִישׁ בֵּן״ – בֵּן הַסָּמוּךְ לִגְבוּרָתוֹ שֶׁל אִישׁ.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Rav says: as the verse states: “If a man has a son” a son who is close to the strength of a man,
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: As the verse states, "If a man has a son" - a son who is close to his father's strength.

hebrew_text: וְעַד שֶׁיַּקִּיף זָקָן הַתַּחְתּוֹן כּוּ׳. תָּנֵי רַבִּי חִיָּיא: עַד שֶׁיַּקִּיף עֲטָרָה. כִּי אֲתָא רַב דִּימִי אָמַר: הַקָּפַת גִּיד, וְלֹא הַקָּפַת בֵּיצִים.
human_translation: until he has grown a lower beard. Rabbi Ḥiyya teaches Until surrounds the corona. When Rav Dimi came he said surrounding the penis and not surrounding testicles,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And until the lower elder encircles." Rabbi Hiyya taught: "Until the crown encircles." When Rav Dimi came, he said: "The encircling of the sinew, not the encircling of the eggs."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: קָטָן שֶׁהוֹלִיד, אֵין בְּנוֹ נַעֲשֶׂה בֵּן סוֹרֵר וּמוֹרֶה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי יִהְיֶה לְאִישׁ בֵּן״ – לְאִישׁ בֵּן, וְלֹא לְבֵן בֵּן. הַאי מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְכִדְרַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב! אִם כֵּן, לֵימָא קְרָא: ״כִּי יִהְיֶה בֵּן לְאִישׁ״. מַאי ״כִּי יִהְיֶה לְאִישׁ בֵּן״? שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ לְכִדְרַב חִסְדָּא.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda says: a minor who fathered his son cannot become a stubborn and rebellious son, as it is stated: “If a man has son,” a man has a son, but not a son, has a son. he require this to which Rav Yehuda says Rav says, were let the verse say: If there be a son to a man. what “If a man has a son”? Conclude from it to of Rav Ḥisda.
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: A minor who begets, his son does not become a rebellious and defiant son, as it is stated: "If a man has a wayward and defiant son" (Deuteronomy 21:18) – "to a man son," and not to a son's son. This that he requires it according to Rav Yehudah who said in the name of Rav! If so, let the verse say: "If a man has a son." What is the meaning of "If a man has a wayward and defiant son"? Learn from it according to Rav Ḥisda.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא: כּוּלֵּיהּ לְהָכִי הוּא דַּאֲתָא? אִם כֵּן, נֵימָא קְרָא ״בֶּן אִישׁ״. מַאי ״לְאִישׁ בֵּן״? שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ תַּרְתֵּי.
human_translation: say the entire comes to this, If so, the verse should have stated: the son of a man. What a man has a son”? Conclude two from it,
llm_translation: And why? All of it to this is that he came? If so, let it be said, the verse says "son of man." What is "to a man son"? Learn from it two.

hebrew_text: וּפְלִיגָא דְּרַבָּה, דְּאָמַר רַבָּה: קָטָן אֵינוֹ מוֹלִיד, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְאִם אֵין לָאִישׁ גֹּאֵל״. וְכִי יֵשׁ לְךָ אָדָם בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁאֵין לוֹ גּוֹאֵל?
human_translation: And disagrees with of Rabba, as Rabba says A minor cannot father as it is stated: “But if the man has no relative And is there any man in the Jewish people who does not have a relative?
llm_translation: And the dispute of Rabba, for Rabba said: A minor does not beget, as it is stated: "But if there is no redeemer for him." And do you have a man in Israel who has no redeemer?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, בְּגֶזֶל הַגֵּר הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר.
human_translation: Rather, the verse is speaking of the robbery of a convert,
llm_translation: Rather, in the theft of the convert the Scripture speaks.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַחֲמָנָא: ״אִישׁ״. אִישׁ – אַתָּה צָרִיךְ לַחֲזוֹר עָלָיו אִם יֵשׁ לוֹ גּוֹאֲלִין וְאִם לָאו. קָטָן – אִי אַתָּה צָרִיךְ לַחֲזוֹר עָלָיו, בְּיָדוּעַ שֶׁאֵין לוֹ גּוֹאֲלִין.
human_translation: And the Merciful One states: man a man you must go around whether or not he has relatives, a minor, you do not have to go around it is known that he has no relative,
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "And the Merciful One said: 'Man.' Man - you must investigate him if he has redeemers or not. A minor - you do not need to investigate him, it is known that he has no redeemers."

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: ״אִישׁ״ – אֵין לִי אֶלָּא אִישׁ. בֶּן תֵּשַׁע שָׁנִים וְיוֹם אֶחָד שֶׁרָאוּי לְבִיאָה מִנַּיִין? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְאִישׁ״.
human_translation: Abaye raised an objection to “man,” I have only man. aged nine years and one day, who is fit for intercourse, from where The verse states: “And a man.”
llm_translation: He raised an objection to him, Abaye: "Man" - I have nothing but a man. A boy of nine years and one day, how do we know he is fit for intercourse? The Talmud teaches: "And a man."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: יֵשׁ לוֹ וְאֵינוֹ מוֹלִיד, כִּתְבוּאָה שֶׁלֹּא הֵבִיאָה שְׁלִישׁ דָּמֵי.
human_translation: said to has he cannot father like grain that had not reached one-third
llm_translation: He said to him: He has it and does not give birth, a written document that did not bring a third of the blood.

hebrew_text: דְּבֵי חִזְקִיָּה תָּנָא: ״וְכִי יָזִד אִישׁ״ – אִישׁ מֵזִיד וּמַזְרִיעַ, וְאֵין קָטָן מֵזִיד וּמַזְרִיעַ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב מָרְדֳּכַי לְרַב אָשֵׁי: מַאי מַשְׁמַע דְּהַאי ״מֵזִיד״ לִישָּׁנָא דְּבַשּׁוֹלֵי הוּא? דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיָּזֶד יַעֲקֹב נָזִיד״.
human_translation: of the school of Ḥizkiyya taught: “But if a man comes intentionally [ yazid ] a man can heat [ mezid ] and produce sperm, but a minor cannot heat and produce sperm. Rav Mordekhai said to Rav Ashi: From where may be inferred that this mezid is a term heating As it is written “And Jacob cooked [ vayyazed ] pottage”
llm_translation: In the study hall of Hezekiah, a Tanna taught: "And if a man acts presumptuously" - a man who acts presumptuously is liable to both intentional and unintentional consequences, but a minor is not liable to both intentional and unintentional consequences. Rav Mordechai said to Rav Ashi: What is the implication that this "intentional" refers to someone who cooks? As it is written: "And Jacob cooked a stew."

hebrew_text: וְהָא תָּנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: ״בֵּן״ – וְלֹא אָב?
human_translation: But didn’t the school of Rabbi Yishmael teach a son but not a father,
llm_translation: And this is what was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael: "Son" - and not "father"?

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִילֵּימָא דְּאִיעַבַּר בָּתַר דְּאַיְיתִי שְׁתֵּי שְׂעָרוֹת, וְאוֹלֵיד מִקַּמֵּי דְּלַקֵּיף זָקָן – מִי אִיכָּא שְׁהוּת כּוּלֵּי הַאי? וְהָא אָמַר רַבִּי כְּרוּסְפָּדַאי: כׇּל יָמָיו שֶׁל בֵּן סוֹרֵר וּמוֹרֶה אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא שְׁלֹשָׁה חֳדָשִׁים בִּלְבַד! אֶלָּא לָאו דְּאִיעַבַּר מִקַּמֵּי דְּלַיְיתֵי שְׁתֵּי שְׂעָרוֹת, וְאוֹלֵיד מִקַּמֵּיהּ דְּלַקֵּיף זָקָן, וּשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: קָטָן מוֹלֵיד!
human_translation: What are the circumstances? If we say that conceived after he grew two hairs and was born before he grew a beard around is there such a long interval But doesn’t Rabbi Kruspedai say: The entire time a stubborn and rebellious son is only three months, Rather, is it not that conceived before he grew two hairs, and was born before he grew a beard around And you can learn from it a minor can, father
llm_translation: How are the cases similar? Perhaps you will say that if two hairs grew after he brought two hairs, and he gave birth before he grew a beard - is there such a case? But Rabbi Kruspedai said: The entire period of a wayward and rebellious son is only three months! Rather, if two hairs grew before he brought two hairs, and he gave birth before he grew a beard, and learn from it: A minor gives birth!

hebrew_text: לָא, לְעוֹלָם דְּאִיעַבַּר בָּתַר דְּאַיְיתִי שְׁתֵּי שְׂעָרוֹת, וְאוֹלִיד בָּתַר דְּאַקֵּיף זָקָן. וּדְקָא קַשְׁיָא דְּרַבִּי כְּרוּסְפָּדַאי – כִּי אֲתָא רַב דִּימִי אֲמַר: אָמְרִי בְּמַעְרְבָא ״בֵּן״ – וְלֹא הָרָאוּי לִקְרוֹתוֹ אָב.
human_translation: No, actually, that conceived after he grew two hairs, and was born after he grew a beard around And that which difficult of Rabbi Kruspedai When Rav Dimi came he said they say in the West, a son but not one who is fit to be called a father.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: No, rather, it is better to have two hairs come after one another, and give birth after one has grown old. And the difficulty of Rabbi Krosfapdai is resolved - for Rav Dimi came and said: They said in the West, "son" - and not fitting to call him "father."

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא, אָמַר רַבִּי כְּרוּסְפָּדַאי אָמַר רַבִּי שַׁבְּתַי: כׇּל יָמָיו שֶׁל בֵּן סוֹרֵר וּמוֹרֶה אֵינָן אֶלָּא שְׁלֹשָׁה חֳדָשִׁים בִּלְבַד. וְהָאֲנַן תְּנַן: מִשֶּׁיָּבִיא שְׁתֵּי שְׂעָרוֹת וְעַד שֶׁיַּקִּיף זָקָן! הִקִּיף זָקָן – אַף עַל גַּב דְּלָא מְלוֹ שְׁלֹשָׁה חֳדָשִׁים. מְלוֹ שְׁלֹשָׁה חֳדָשִׁים – אַף עַל גַּב דְּלֹא הִקִּיף.
human_translation: the itself: Rabbi Kruspedai says Rabbi Shabbtai says: The entire time a stubborn and rebellious son is only three months. But didn’t we learn from when he grows two hairs until he grows a beard around he grew a beard around even if three months have not passed, three months passed, even if he has not grown around
llm_translation: The body, Rabbi Kruspaddai said, Rabbi Shabbetai said: all his days of a wayward and rebellious son are only three months. And we learned: from when he grows two hairs until he grows a beard! When he grows a beard - even though he has not completed three months. If he completes three months - even though he has not grown a beard.

hebrew_text: יָתֵיב רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב מִנְּהַר פְּקוֹד קַמֵּיהּ דְּרָבִינָא, וְיָתֵיב וְקָאָמַר מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ מִדְּרַבִּי כְּרוּסְפָּדַאי אָמַר רַבִּי שַׁבְּתַי, יוֹלֶדֶת לְשִׁבְעָה אֵין עוּבָּרָהּ נִיכָּר לִשְׁלִישׁ יָמֶיהָ.
human_translation: Rabbi Ya’akov from Nehar Pekod sat before Ravina and sat and said in the name of Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua: Learn from that Rabbi Kruspedai Rabbi Shabbtai says gives birth at seven her fetus cannot be discerned after one-third of her days
llm_translation: Rabbi Yaakov sat by the bank of the river Pekod before Ravina, and he sat and said in the name of Rav Huna son of Rav Yehoshua: "Learn from it, from Rabbi Cruspedai said Rabbi Shabtai, if she gives birth after seven months, her pregnancy is recognizable by the third day."

hebrew_text: דְּאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ: עוּבָּרָהּ נִיכָּר לִשְׁלִישׁ יָמֶיהָ, לְמָה לִי שְׁלֹשָׁה? בִּתְרֵי וְתִילְתָּא סַגִּיא!
human_translation: As if it enters your mind her fetus can be discerned after one-third of her days why do I three two and one-third suffice.
llm_translation: If it is according to your opinion: her pregnancy is recognizable after three months, why do I need three? Two and a half are sufficient!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לְעוֹלָם אֵימָא לָךְ, עוּבָּרָהּ נִיכָּר לִשְׁלִישׁ יָמֶיהָ. זִיל בָּתַר רוּבָּא.
human_translation: said to Actually, I say to you her fetus can be discerned after one-third of her days follows the majority.
llm_translation: He said to him: Always say to her, her pregnancy is recognizable after three months. Go after the majority.

hebrew_text: אַמְרוּהָ קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ. אָמַר לֵיהּ: וּבְדִינֵי נְפָשׁוֹת מִי אָזְלִינַן בָּתַר רוּבָּא? הַתּוֹרָה אָמְרָה: ״וְשָׁפְטוּ הָעֵדָה וְהִצִּילוּ הָעֵדָה״, וְאַתְּ אָמְרַתְּ זִיל בָּתַר רוּבָּא?!
human_translation: stated this before Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, he said to But do we follow the majority in capital law the Torah state: “And the congregation shall judge…and the congregation shall deliver” and you say follows the majority?
llm_translation: They said it before Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua. He said to them: And in cases of capital punishment, do we follow the majority opinion? The Torah says: "And the congregation shall judge, and they shall save the congregation." And you say, go after the majority opinion?!

hebrew_text: אַהְדְּרוּהָ קַמֵּיהּ דְּרָבִינָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: וּבְדִינֵי נְפָשׁוֹת לָא אָזְלִינַן בָּתַר רוּבָּא? וְהָתְנַן: אֶחָד אוֹמֵר ״בִּשְׁנַיִם בַּחֹדֶשׁ״ וְאֶחָד אוֹמֵר ״בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה״, עֵדוּתָן קַיֶּימֶת, שֶׁזֶּה יוֹדֵעַ בְּעִיבּוּרוֹ שֶׁל חֹדֶשׁ וְזֶה אֵינוֹ יוֹדֵעַ.
human_translation: brought back to Ravina before said to And do we not follow the majority in capital law? But didn’t we learn one says on the second of the month, and one says on the third their testimony stands, that this knows of addition of month, and that does not know
llm_translation: He returned and stood before Ravina. He said to him: And in cases of capital punishment, do we not follow the majority? But didn't we learn: One says "on the second of the month" and one says "on the third," their testimony is valid, because this one knows the new moon's appearance and that one does not know.

hebrew_text: וְאִי סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ לָא אָמְרִינַן זִיל בָּתַר רוּבָּא, נֵימָא: הָנֵי דַּוְקָא קָא מַסְהֲדִי, וְאַכְחוֹשֵׁי הוּא דְּקָא מַכְחֲשִׁי אַהֲדָדֵי! אֶלָּא לָאו מִשּׁוּם דְּאָמְרִינַן זִיל בָּתַר רוּבָּא, וְרוּבָּא דְאִינָשֵׁי עֲבִדִי דְּטָעוּ בְּעִיבּוּרָא דְּיַרְחָא?
human_translation: And if it enters your mind we do not say follows the majority let us say these are testifying with precision, and they contradict each other, Rather, is it not because we say follows the majority, and the majority of people are apt to err with regard to the addition to the month?
llm_translation: If your mind is at ease, we do not say, "Go after the majority." Rather, say: Those specifically testifying are believed, and it is the suspicion that they are contradicting each other! But is it not because we say, "Go after the majority," and the majority of people are mistaken in the sighting of the moon?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה מִדִּפְתִּי: אַף אֲנַן נָמֵי תְּנֵינָא, בַּת שָׁלֹשׁ שָׁנִים וְיוֹם אֶחָד מִתְקַדֶּשֶׁת בְּבִיאָה, וְאִם בָּא עָלֶיהָ יָבָם – קְנָאָהּ, וְחַיָּיבִין עָלֶיהָ מִשּׁוּם אֵשֶׁת אִישׁ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya of Difti says: We learn as well three years and one day old can be betrothed with intercourse, And if yavam , engages in intercourse with her, he acquires her And liable with her due to a married woman.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya from Difti said: We also learned, a girl of three years and one day becomes betrothed through intercourse, and if her brother-in-law engages in intercourse with her - he acquires her, and they are obligated concerning her as a married woman.

hebrew_text: וּמְטַמְּאָה אֶת בּוֹעֲלָהּ, לְטַמֵּא מִשְׁכָּב הַתַּחְתּוֹן כְּעֶלְיוֹן. נִישֵּׂאת לַכֹּהֵן – אוֹכֶלֶת בִּתְרוּמָה. בָּא עָלֶיהָ אֶחָד מִן הַפְּסוּלִין – פְּסָלָהּ מִן הַכְּהוּנָּה. וְאִם בָּא עָלֶיהָ אֶחָד מִכׇּל הָעֲרָיוֹת הָאֲמוּרוֹת בְּתוֹרָה – מוּמָתִין עָלֶיהָ, וְהִיא פְּטוּרָה.
human_translation: And she transmits impurity to one who engages in intercourse with her, renders lying beneath impure like above she marries a priest, she may partake of teruma one who is unfit engaged in intercourse with her, he has disqualified her from the priesthood, And if one of any of those with whom relations are forbidden, which are enumerated in the Torah, engaged in intercourse with her, executed by her, and she is exempt
llm_translation: And she defiles her husband, to defile the lower bed as the upper. If she is married to a Kohen - she may eat Terumah. If one of the disqualifying factors comes upon her - he disqualifies her from the priesthood. But if any of the forbidden relationships mentioned in the Torah come upon her - they are liable for death, but she is exempt.

hebrew_text: אַמַּאי? אֵימָא: אַיְילוֹנִית הִיא, וְאַדַּעְתָּא דְּהָכִי לָא קַדֵּישׁ! אֶלָּא, לָאו דְּאָמְרִינַן: זִיל בָּתַר רוּבָּא, וְרוֹב נָשִׁים לָאו אַיְילוֹנִית נִינְהוּ.
human_translation: Why Say she is a sexually underdeveloped woman [ ailonit ] and did not betroth her with this understanding; Rather, is it not that we say follows the majority, and the majority of women are not sexually underdeveloped women,
llm_translation: Why? Say: It is a terebinth tree, and the knowledge that it is not holy! Rather, do we not say: Go after the majority, and the majority of women are not terebinth trees.

hebrew_text: לָא, מַאי ״חַיָּיב עָלֶיהָ״ דְּקָתָנֵי? קׇרְבָּן.
human_translation: No; what that is taught liable with her sin-offering,
llm_translation: Not, what "is obligated upon it" that it teaches? Sacrifice.

hebrew_text: וְהָא ״מוּמָתִין עַל יָדָהּ״ קָתָנֵי? בְּבָא עָלֶיהָ אָבִיהָ.
human_translation: But wasn’t it taught executed by her? where her father engaged in intercourse with her,
llm_translation: "And this, 'Mumatin al yadah' - where is it taught? In Bava, her father comes upon her."

hebrew_text: וְהָא ״אִם בָּא עָלֶיהָ אֶחָד מִכׇּל הָעֲרָיוֹת״ קָתָנֵי? אֶלָּא, הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן: דְּקַבְּלַהּ עִילָּוֵיהּ.
human_translation: But wasn’t it taught: If one of any of those with whom relations are forbidden engaged in intercourse with her, Rather, what are we dealing with here? where accepted her upon himself
llm_translation: "And here, 'if one of all the cities came upon her,' is it taught? Rather, here we are dealing with what: that she accepted it willingly."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הַמְסוֹלֶלֶת בִּבְנָהּ קָטָן, וְהֶעֱרָה בָּהּ – בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: פְּסָלָהּ מִן הַכְּהוּנָּה, וּבֵית הִלֵּל מַכְשִׁירִין.
human_translation: The Sages taught was acting lewdly with her minor son and he performed the initial stage of intercourse with her, Beit Shammai say he has disqualified her from the priesthood. And Beit Hillel deem her fit
llm_translation: The Sages taught: One who entices his minor daughter to engage in forbidden sexual relations, and she is seduced - Beit Shammai say: She is disqualified from the priesthood, and Beit Hillel declare her fit.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַבָּה בַּר נַחְמָנִי: אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא אָמַר זְעֵירִי: הַכֹּל מוֹדִים בְּבֶן תֵּשַׁע שָׁנִים וְיוֹם אֶחָד שֶׁבִּיאָתוֹ בִּיאָה, פָּחוֹת מִבֶּן שְׁמֹנֶה שֶׁאֵין בִּיאָתוֹ בִּיאָה. לֹא נֶחְלְקוּ אֶלָּא בְּבֶן שְׁמֹנֶה, דְּבֵית שַׁמַּאי סָבְרִי: גָּמְרִינַן מִדּוֹרוֹת הָרִאשׁוֹנִים, וּבֵית הִלֵּל סָבְרִי: לָא גָּמְרִינַן מִדּוֹרוֹת הָרִאשׁוֹנִים.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya, son of Rabba bar Naḥmani, says Rav Ḥisda says, and some say Rav Ḥisda says Ze’eiri says: All, concede with regard to nine years and one day old that his intercourse intercourse less than eight years old that his intercourse not intercourse They disagree only about eight years old, as Beit Shammai maintain we learn from earlier generations, and Beit Hillel maintain we do not learn from earlier generations.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Chiya, son of Rabba bar Nachmani: Said Rav Chisda, and some say he said Rav Chisda said Zeiri: Everyone agrees regarding a nine-year-old boy, one day, that his arrival is considered an arrival, less than an eight-year-old boy, his arrival is not considered an arrival. They only disagreed regarding an eight-year-old boy, for Beit Shammai holds: We consider the earlier generations to have completed their learning, and Beit Hillel holds: We do not consider the earlier generations to have completed their learning.

hebrew_text: וְדוֹרוֹת הָרִאשׁוֹנִים מְנָלַן דְּאוֹלִיד? אִילֵּימָא מִדִּכְתִיב: ״הֲלוֹא זֹאת בַּת שֶׁבַע בַּת אֱלִיעָם אֵשֶׁת אוּרִיָּה הַחִתִּי״, וּכְתִיב: ״אֱלִיעָם בֶּן אֲחִיתֹפֶל הַגִּלֹנִי״, וּכְתִיב: ״וַיִּשְׁלַח בְּיַד נָתָן הַנָּבִיא וַיִּקְרָא אֶת שְׁמוֹ יְדִידְיָהּ בַּעֲבוּר (כִּי) ה׳ (אֲהֵבוֹ)״.
human_translation: And from where do we that earlier generations fathered If we say from It is written: “Is this not Bathsheba, daughter of Eliam, wife of Uriah the Hittite?” And it is written: “And Eliam, son of Ahithophel the Gilonite” And it is written “And he sent by the hand of Nathan the prophet, and he called his name Jedidiah, for the Lord’s sake”
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "And the generations of the first, from where are they descended? If you say from what is written: 'Is this not Bathsheba, the daughter of Eliam, the wife of Uriah the Hittite,' and it is written: 'Eliam the son of Ahithophel the Gilonite,' and it is written: 'And he sent by the hand of Nathan the prophet and called his name Jedidiah for the sake of the Lord (loved him)." This is the English translation of the provided Talmudic text.

hebrew_text: וּכְתִיב: ״וַיְהִי לִשְׁנָתַיִם יָמִים וַיִּהְיוּ גֹזְזִים לְאַבְשָׁלוֹם״, וּכְתִיב: ״וְאַבְשָׁלוֹם בָּרַח וַיֵּלֶךְ גְּשׁוּרָה וַיְהִי שָׁם שָׁלֹשׁ שָׁנִים״.
human_translation: And it is written: “And it came to pass after two years, that Absalom had sheepshearers” And it is written: “So Absalom fled, and went to Geshur, and was there three years”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it is written: "And it came to pass after two years, that Absalom had sheepshearers in Baal-hazor" (2 Samuel 13:23), and it is written: "But Absalom fled, and went to Geshur, and was there three years" (2 Samuel 13:37).

hebrew_text: וּכְתִיב: ״וַיֵּשֶׁב אַבְשָׁלוֹם בִּירוּשָׁלִַים שְׁנָתַיִם יָמִים וּפְנֵי הַמֶּלֶךְ לֹא רָאָה״. וּכְתִיב: ״וַיְהִי מִקֵּץ אַרְבָּעִים שָׁנָה וַיֹּאמֶר אַבְשָׁלוֹם אֶל הַמֶּלֶךְ אֵלְכָה נָּא וַאֲשַׁלְּמָה אֶת נִדְרִי אֲשֶׁר נָדַרְתִּי לַה׳ בְּחֶבְרוֹן״. וּכְתִיב: ״וַאֲחִיתֹפֶל רָאָה כִּי לֹא נֶעֶשְׂתָה עֲצָתוֹ וַיַּחֲבֹשׁ אֶת הַחֲמוֹר וַיָּקׇם וַיֵּלֶךְ אֶל בֵּיתוֹ וְאֶל עִירוֹ וַיְצַו אֶל בֵּיתוֹ וַיֵּחָנַק״.
human_translation: And it is written: “So Absalom dwelt two years in Jerusalem, and did not see the king’s face” And it is written: “And it came to pass after forty years, that Absalom said to the king, I pray you, let me go and pay my vow, which I have vowed to the Lord, in Hebron” And it is written: “And when Ahithophel saw that his counsel was not followed, he saddled his donkey, and arose, and went to his house, to his city, and put his household in order, and strangled himself
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it is written: "And Absalom dwelt in Jerusalem two years, and the king saw not his face." And it is written: "And it came to pass after forty years, that Absalom said unto the king: 'Let me go and pay my vow, which I have vowed unto the Lord, in Hebron.'" And it is written: "And Ahithophel saw that his counsel was not followed, and he saddled his donkey, and arose, and went to his house, to his city, and set his house in order, and hanged himself."

hebrew_text: וּכְתִיב: ״אַנְשֵׁי דָמִים וּמִרְמָה לֹא יֶחֱצוּ יְמֵיהֶם״. וְתַנְיָא: כׇּל שְׁנוֹתָיו שֶׁל דּוֹאֵג אֵינָן אֶלָּא שְׁלֹשִׁים וְאַרְבַּע, וְשֶׁל אֲחִיתֹפֶל אֵינָן אֶלָּא שְׁלֹשִׁים וְשָׁלֹשׁ. כַּמָּה הָוְיָא לְהוּ? תְּלָתִין וּתְלָת. דַּל שְׁבַע דַּהֲוָה שְׁלֹמֹה, פָּשׁ לְהוּ עֶשְׂרִים וְשֵׁית. דַּל תַּרְתֵּי שְׁנֵי לִתְלָתָא עִבּוּרֵי, אִשְׁתְּכַח דְּכֹל חַד וְחַד בְּתַמְנֵי אוֹלֵיד.
human_translation: And it is written: “Bloody and deceitful men shall not live out half their days” And it is taught All of Doeg’s years were only thirty-four and Ahithophel’s were only thirty-three. How many Thirty-three. Subtract seven Solomon’s leaves twenty-six Subtract two years for three pregnancies, It turns out that each and every begot at eight.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it is written: "Men of bloodshed and deceit will not live out half their days." And it was taught: All the years of Doeg were only thirty-four, and those of Ahithophel were only thirty-three. How was it for them? Thirty and three. When Solomon became poor, he was left with twenty-six. When two years were added to three, it was found that each and every one of them gave birth to eight.

hebrew_text: מִמַּאי? דִּלְמָא תַּרְוַיְיהוּ בִּתְשַׁע אוֹלֵיד, וּבַת שֶׁבַע אוֹלִידָא בְּשֵׁית, מִשּׁוּם דְּאִיתְּתָא בָּרְיָא. תֵּדַע, דְּהָא הֲוַי לַהּ וָלָד מֵעִיקָּרָא.
human_translation: From where Perhaps both fathered when nine and Bathsheba gave birth when six, because a woman is stronger Know as had already a child
llm_translation: From where? Perhaps both are born at nine, and a daughter at seven is born at six, because there is a difference in the creation. You should know that this is the case from the outset.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מֵהָכָא: ״אֵלֶּה תּוֹלְדֹת תֶּרַח תֶּרַח הוֹלִיד אֶת אַבְרָם אֶת נָחוֹר וְאֶת הָרָן״. וְאַבְרָהָם גָּדוֹל מִנָּחוֹר שָׁנָה, וְנָחוֹר גָּדוֹל מֵהָרָן שָׁנָה. נִמְצָא אַבְרָהָם גָּדוֹל שְׁתֵּי שָׁנִים מֵהָרָן. וּכְתִיב: ״וַיִּקַּח אַבְרָם וְנָחוֹר לָהֶם נָשִׁים וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: Rather, from here “And these are the generations of Terah; Terah begot Abram, Nahor, and Haran” And Abraham was one year older than Nahor, and Nahor was one year older than Haran, it turns out Abraham was two years older than Haran. And it is written: “And Abram and Nahor took wives for themselves;
llm_translation: Rather, from here: "These are the generations of Terach: Terach fathered Avram, Nachor, and Haran." And Avraham was greater than Nachor by two years, and Nachor was greater than Haran by two years. Thus, Avraham was found to be two years greater than Haran. And it is written: "And Avram took Avram and Nachor wives for themselves, etc."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: ״יִסְכָּה״ זוֹ שָׂרָה, וְלָמָּה נִקְרָא שְׁמָהּ ״יִסְכָּה״? שֶׁסּוֹכָה בְּרוּחַ הַקֹּדֶשׁ. וְהַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב: ״כֹּל אֲשֶׁר תֹּאמַר אֵלֶיךָ שָׂרָה שְׁמַע בְּקֹלָהּ״. דָּבָר אַחֵר: ״יִסְכָּה״ – שֶׁהַכֹּל סָכִים בְּיוֹפְיָהּ. וּכְתִיב: ״וַיִּפֹּל [אַבְרָהָם] עַל פָּנָיו וַיִּצְחָק וַיֹּאמֶר בְּלִבּוֹ וְגוֹ׳״. כַּמָּה קַשִּׁישׁ אַבְרָהָם מִשָּׂרָה? עֲשַׂר שְׁנִין. וְקַשִּׁישׁ מֵאֲבוּהּ תַּרְתֵּין שְׁנִין. אִשְׁתְּכַח כִּי אוֹלְדַהּ הָרָן לְשָׂרָה בְּתַמְנֵי אוֹלְדַהּ.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yitzḥak says: Iscah is Sarah. And why was she called Iscah? Because she envisioned [ shesokha ] by means of divine inspiration. And this what is written: “In all that Sarah has said to you, hearken to her voice” Alternatively, Iscah, because all gazed [ sokhim ] upon her beauty. And it is written: “And Abraham fell upon his face, and laughed, and said in his heart: How much older was Abraham than Sarah? ten years and, two years older than her father, It turns out when Haran begot Sarah, he begot her at eight.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yitzchak said: "Yiskah" is Sarah, and why was she called "Yiskah"? Because she was covered with the Holy Spirit. And this is what is written: "Whatever Sarah tells you, listen to her voice." Another explanation: "Yiskah" - because everyone agreed on her beauty. And it is written: "And Abraham fell on his face and laughed, and said in his heart, etc." How much older was Abraham than Sarah? Ten years. And older than her grandfather by twenty-two years. It is found that when Haran was born to Sarah, she was eighty-two years old.

hebrew_text: מִמַּאי? דִּלְמָא אַבְרָהָם זוּטָא דַּאֲחוּהּ הֲוָה, וְדֶרֶךְ חׇכְמָתָן קָא חָשֵׁיב לְהוּ.
human_translation: From where Perhaps Abraham was the youngest of the brothers, and listed them in the order of their wisdom
llm_translation: From what? Perhaps Abraham, the small brother, was, and the way of their wisdom was considered to them.

hebrew_text: תֵּדַע דְּקָא חָשֵׁיב לְהוּ קְרָא דֶּרֶךְ חׇכְמָתָן, וּכְתִיב: ״וַיְהִי נֹחַ בֶּן חֲמֵשׁ מֵאוֹת שָׁנָה וַיּוֹלֶד נֹחַ אֶת שֵׁם אֶת חָם וְאֶת יָפֶת״. שֵׁם גָּדוֹל מֵחָם שָׁנָה, וְחָם גָּדוֹל מִיֶּפֶת שָׁנָה. נִמְצָא שֵׁם גָּדוֹל מִיֶּפֶת שְׁתֵּי שָׁנִים. וּכְתִיב: ״וְנֹחַ בֶּן שֵׁשׁ מֵאוֹת שָׁנָה וְהַמַּבּוּל הָיָה מַיִם עַל הָאָרֶץ״. וּכְתִיב: ״(וְאֵלֶּה) תּוֹלְדֹת שֵׁם שֵׁם בֶּן מְאַת שָׁנָה וַיּוֹלֶד אֶת אַרְפַּכְשָׁד שְׁנָתַיִם אַחַר הַמַּבּוּל״. בֶּן מֵאָה שָׁנָה? בַּר מְאָה וְתַרְתֵּין שְׁנִין הֲוָה!
human_translation: Know that the verse lists in the order of their wisdom, as it is written: “And Noah was five hundred years old; and Noah begot Shem, Ham, and Japheth” Shem was one year older than Ham, and Ham one year older than Japheth, it turns out Shem was two years older than Japheth. And it is written: “And Noah was six hundred years old when the flood of waters was upon the earth” And it is written: “These are the descendants of Shem; Shem was one hundred years old, and begot Arpachshad two years after the flood” 100 years old? He must have been 102 years old,
llm_translation: You should know that it is considered significant in their wisdom, as it is written: "And Noah was five hundred years old, and Noah begot Shem, Ham, and Japheth." Shem was greater than Ham by two years, and Ham was greater than Japheth by one year. Thus, Shem was greater than Japheth by two years. And it is written: "And Noah was six hundred years old, and the flood of waters was upon the earth." And it is written: "These are the generations of Shem: Shem was a hundred years old, and he begot Arpachshad two years after the flood." A hundred years old? He was one hundred and two years old!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, דֶּרֶךְ חׇכְמָתָן קָא חָשֵׁיב לְהוּ. הָכָא נָמֵי, דֶּרֶךְ חׇכְמָתָן קָא חָשֵׁיב לְהוּ.
human_translation: Rather, listed them in the order of their wisdom, Here too, lists them in the order of their wisdom.
llm_translation: Rather, the way of their wisdom is considered for them. Here too, the way of their wisdom is considered for them.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא: אַמְרִיתַהּ לִשְׁמַעְתָּא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב זְבִיד מִנְּהַרְדְּעָא. אָמַר לִי: אַתּוּן מֵהָכָא מַתְנִיתוּ, וַאֲנַן מֵהָכָא מַתְנֵינַן לַהּ: ״וּלְשֵׁם יֻלַּד גַּם הוּא אֲבִי כׇּל בְּנֵי עֵבֶר אֲחִי יֶפֶת הַגָּדוֹל״. יֶפֶת הַגָּדוֹל שֶׁבְּאֶחָיו הֲוָה.
human_translation: Rav Kahana says: I stated this discussion before Rav Zevid of Neharde’a. he said to me: You learn from there, and we learn it from here: “And to Shem, the father of all the children of Eber, the brother of Japheth the elder, to him also were children born” Japheth, was the oldest of the brothers.
llm_translation: Rav Kahana said: I said it to be heard before Rav Zevid from Nehardea. He said to me: You learn it from here, and we learn it from here: "And to Shem, the father of all the children of Eber, the brother of Japheth the elder." Japheth the elder was among his brothers.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מְנָלַן? מֵהָכָא: ״וּבְצַלְאֵל בֶּן אוּרִי בֶן חוּר לְמַטֵּה יְהוּדָה״, וּכְתִיב: ״וַתָּמׇת עֲזוּבָה אֵשֶׁת כָּלֵב וַיִּקַּח לוֹ כָלֵב אֶת אֶפְרָת וַתֵּלֶד לוֹ אֶת חוּר״. וְכִי עֲבַד בְּצַלְאֵל מִשְׁכָּן בַּר כַּמָּה הָוֵי? בַּר תְּלֵיסַר, דִּכְתִיב: ״אִישׁ אִישׁ מִמְּלַאכְתּוֹ אֲשֶׁר הֵמָּה עֹשִׂים״. וְתַנְיָא: שָׁנָה רִאשׁוֹנָה עָשָׂה מֹשֶׁה מִשְׁכָּן, שְׁנִיָּה הֵקִים מִשְׁכָּן וְשָׁלַח מְרַגְּלִים.
human_translation: Rather, from where do we From here, “And Bezalel, son of Uri, son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah, And it is written: “And Azubah died, and Caleb took for himself Ephrat, who bore him Hur. And when Bezalel made the Tabernacle how old was he? thirteen years old, as it is written: every man from his work that they did” And it is taught In the first year Moses made the Tabernacle; in the second he erected the Tabernacle and sent out the spies.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rather, from where do we derive this? From here: "And Bezalel son of Uri son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah," and it is written: "And Azubah died, the wife of Caleb, and Caleb took to himself Ephrath, and she bore him Hur." And did Bezalel work on the Tabernacle at what age? At thirteen, as it is written: "Each man with his work that they were doing." And it was taught: In the first year, Moses made the Tabernacle; in the second year, he erected the Tabernacle and sent spies.

hebrew_text: וּכְתִיב: ״בֶּן אַרְבָּעִים שָׁנָה אָנֹכִי בִּשְׁלֹחַ מֹשֶׁה עֶבֶד ה׳ וְגוֹ׳״, ״וְעַתָּה הִנֵּה אָנֹכִי הַיּוֹם בֶּן חָמֵשׁ וּשְׁמֹנִים שָׁנָה״. כַּמָּה הָוְיָא לְהוּ? אַרְבְּעִין. דַּל אַרְבֵּיסַר דַּהֲוָה בְּצַלְאֵל, פָּשָׁא לְהוּ עֶשְׂרִים וְשֵׁית. דַּל תַּרְתֵּי שְׁנֵי דִּתְלָתָא עִיבּוּרֵי, אִשְׁתְּכַח דְּכֹל חַד וְחַד בְּתַמְנֵי אוֹלֵיד.
human_translation: And it is written “I was forty years old when Moses the servant of the Lord sent “And now, behold, I am this day eighty-five years old” How many was forty. Subtract fourteen as Bezalel was leaves twenty-six Subtract two years for three pregnancies, It turns out that each and every begot at eight.
llm_translation: "And it is written: 'At the age of forty years, I am when Moses, the servant of the Lord, sent me, etc.' 'And now, behold, I am today eighty-five years old.' How many years were there for him? Forty. For at the age of twelve, when he was in the shadow of Zalael, he separated from them twenty-six. For two or three years of the forty, he was in the school of Eber, and it is found that each and every one of them gave birth to twins."

hebrew_text: בֵּן, וְלֹא בַּת. תַּנְיָא: אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: בְּדִין הוּא שֶׁתְּהֵא בַּת רְאוּיָה לִהְיוֹת כְּבֵן סוֹרֵר וּמוֹרֶה,
human_translation: a son, but not a daughter. It is taught Rabbi Shimon says: It would be reasonable a daughter should be fit to be like a stubborn and rebellious son,
llm_translation: Son, and not daughter. It was taught: Rabbi Shimon said: It is proper that a daughter should be fit to be like a rebellious and defiant son.

hebrew_text: שֶׁהַכֹּל מְצוּיִין אֶצְלָהּ בַּעֲבֵירָה, אֶלָּא גְּזֵירַת הַכָּתוּב הִיא: ״בֵּן״, וְלֹא בַּת.
human_translation: that all are found with her in sin, But it is a Torah edict a son, and not a daughter.
llm_translation: The text reads: "that all are found by her in transgression, except the decree of the Scripture: 'son,' and not 'daughter.'"

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מֵאֵימָתַי חַיָּיב? מִשֶּׁיֹּאכַל תַּרְטֵימָר בָּשָׂר, וְיִשְׁתֶּה חֲצִי לוֹג יַיִן הָאִיטַלְקִי. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: מָנֶה בָּשָׂר, וְלוֹג יַיִן.
human_translation: From when liable? From when he eats a tarteimar of meat and drinks a half- log of Italian wine. Rabbi Yosei says: a maneh of meat and a log of wine.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: From when is one obligated? From when he eats a kezayit of meat and drinks half a log of Italian wine. Rabbi Yosei says: A portion of meat and a log of wine.

hebrew_text: אָכַל בַּחֲבוּרַת מִצְוָה, אָכַל בְּעִיבּוּר הַחֹדֶשׁ, אָכַל מַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם, אָכַל נְבֵילוֹת וּטְרֵיפוֹת שְׁקָצִים וּרְמָשִׂים (אָכַל טֶבֶל וּמַעֲשֵׂר רִאשׁוֹן שֶׁלֹּא נִטְּלָה תְּרוּמָתוֹ וּמַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי וְהֶקְדֵּשׁ שֶׁלֹּא נִפְדּוּ).
human_translation: he ate with a group of a mitzva, he ate at the intercalation of a month, he ate second tithe in Jerusalem, he ate animal carcasses or animals that had wounds that would have caused them to die within twelve months [ tereifot ] repugnant creatures or creeping animals, he ate untithed produce or first tithe from which its teruma was not separated, or second tithe or consecrated food that was not redeemed,
llm_translation: He ate in a group of mitzvah, he ate in the eve of the new month, he ate second tithe in Jerusalem, he ate neveilah, terefah, abominations, and creeping things (he ate tevel and first tithe that its terumah was not taken, and second tithe and consecrated items that were not redeemed).

hebrew_text: אָכַל דָּבָר שֶׁהוּא מִצְוָה, וְדָבָר שֶׁהוּא עֲבֵירָה, אָכַל כׇּל מַאֲכָל וְלֹא אָכַל בָּשָׂר, שָׁתָה כׇּל מַשְׁקֶה וְלֹא שָׁתָה יַיִן – אֵינוֹ נַעֲשֶׂה בֵּן סוֹרֵר וּמוֹרֶה עַד שֶׁיֹּאכַל בָּשָׂר וְיִשְׁתֶּה יַיִן, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״זוֹלֵל וְסֹבֵא״. וְאַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין רְאָיָה לַדָּבָר, זֵכֶר לַדָּבָר שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אַל תְּהִי בְסֹבְאֵי יָיִן בְּזֹלְלֵי בָשָׂר לָמוֹ״.
human_translation: he ate an item that a mitzva or an item that a transgression, he ate any food but did not eat meat, drank any beverage but did not drink wine, he does not become a stubborn and rebellious son, unless he eats meat and drinks wine, as it is stated: is a glutton [ zolel ] and a drunkard [ vesovei ]” And although there is no proof to the matter there is an allusion to the matter as it is stated: “Be not among wine drinkers [ besovei ], among gluttonous eaters [ bezolelei ] of meat”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Ate a matter that is a commandment, and a matter that is a transgression, ate all food and did not eat meat, drank all beverages and did not drink wine - he does not become a rebellious son and a stubborn one until he eats meat and drinks wine, as it is stated: "A glutton and a drunkard." And even though there is no actual proof for the matter, it is a reminder of the matter as it is stated: "Do not be among the drinkers of wine, among the gluttonous eaters of meat for themselves."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: תַּרְטֵימָר זֶה אֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ מַהוּ, אֶלָּא מִתּוֹךְ שֶׁכָּפַל רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּיַיִן, נִמְצָא כּוֹפֵל אַף בַּבָּשָׂר, וְנִמְצָא תַּרְטֵימָר חֲצִי מָנֶה.
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira says: this tarteimar I do not know what is. But since Rabbi Yosei doubled of the wine, is found doubled the meat as well. turns out a tarteimar one-half of a maneh .
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara, Rabbi Zeira said: "Tarteimar, this I do not know what it is, but since Rabbi Yosei doubled in wine, it was found that he also doubled in meat, and it was found that Tarteimar is half a Maneh."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חָנָן בַּר מוֹלָדָה אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב עַד שֶׁיִּקַּח בָּשָׂר בְּזוֹל וְיֹאכַל, יַיִן בְּזוֹל וְיִשְׁתֶּה, דִּכְתִיב: ״זוֹלֵל וְסֹבֵא״.
human_translation: Rav Ḥanan bar Molada says Rav Huna says: is not liable unless he purchases inexpensive [ bezol ] meat and eats inexpensive wine and drinks as it is written: a glutton [ zolel ] and a drunkard.”
llm_translation: Rav Hanan bar Moladah said in the name of Rav Huna: One is not liable until he takes meat at a low price and eats, wine at a low price and drinks, as it is written: "A glutton and a drunkard."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב חָנָן בַּר מוֹלָדָה אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב עַד שֶׁיֹּאכַל בָּשָׂר חַי וְיִשְׁתֶּה יַיִן חַי. אִינִי? וְהָא רַבָּה וְרַב יוֹסֵף דְּאָמְרִי תַּרְוַויְיהוּ: אָכַל בָּשָׂר חַי וְשָׁתָה יַיִן חַי אֵינוֹ נַעֲשֶׂה בֵּן סוֹרֵר וּמוֹרֶה! אָמַר רָבִינָא: יַיִן חַי – מְזִיג וְלָא מְזִיג, בָּשָׂר חַי – בְּשִׁיל וְלָא בְּשִׁיל, כִּבְשַׂר כִּיבָא דְּאָכְלִי גַּנָּבֵי.
human_translation: And Rav Ḥanan bar Molada says Rav Huna says: is not liable unless he eats raw meat and drinks undiluted wine. Is that so? But don’t Rabba and Rav Yosef both say: he ate raw meat or drank undiluted wine he does not become a stubborn and rebellious son? Ravina said: undiluted wine diluted but not diluted raw meat cooked but not cooked like the scorched meat that thieves eat,
llm_translation: And Rav Hanan bar Moladah said in the name of Rav Huna: One is not liable until he eats raw meat and drinks raw wine. Is it not so? But Rabba and Rav Yosef both said: If one eats raw meat and drinks raw wine, he does not become a rebellious son and a glutton! Ravina said: Raw wine - whether mixed or unmixed, raw meat - whether cooked or uncooked, like the meat that the thieves ate.

hebrew_text: רַבָּה וְרַב יוֹסֵף דְּאָמְרִי תַּרְוַויְיהוּ: אָכַל בָּשָׂר מָלִיחַ וְשָׁתָה יַיִן מִגִּיתּוֹ, אֵין נַעֲשֶׂה בֵּן סוֹרֵר וּמוֹרֶה. תְּנַן הָתָם: עֶרֶב תִּשְׁעָה בְּאָב לֹא יֹאכַל אָדָם שְׁנֵי תַבְשִׁילִין, וְלֹא יֹאכַל בָּשָׂר, וְלֹא יִשְׁתֶּה יַיִן. וְתָנָא: אֲבָל אוֹכֵל הוּא בָּשָׂר מָלִיחַ וְשׁוֹתֶה יַיִן מִגִּתּוֹ.
human_translation: Rabba and Rav Yosef both say: he ate salted meat or drank wine from his winepress, does not become a stubborn and rebellious son. we learned elsewhere the eve of the Ninth of Av, a person may not eat two cooked dishes And he may neither eat meat nor drink wine. And taught But one may eat salted meat, and one many drink wine from his winepress
llm_translation: Rabba and Rav Yosef both said: If one ate salty meat and drank wine from his vat, he does not become a rebellious son and a stubborn one. We learned there: On the eve of the ninth of Av, a person should not eat two cooked dishes, nor eat meat, nor drink wine. And it was taught: But he may eat salty meat and drink wine from his vat.

hebrew_text: בְּבָשָׂר מָלִיחַ, עַד כַּמָּה? אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בַּר כָּהֲנָא: כׇּל זְמַן שֶׁהוּא כִּשְׁלָמִים.
human_translation: salted meat how long Rabbi Ḥanina bar Kahana says: As long as it is like a peace-offering,
llm_translation: In flesh salty, until how much? Said Rabbi Chanina bar Kahana: As long as it is like peace offerings.

hebrew_text: וְיַיִן מִגִּיתּוֹ, עַד כַּמָּה? כׇּל זְמַן שֶׁהוּא תּוֹסֵס. וְהָתַנְיָא: יַיִן תּוֹסֵס אֵין בּוֹ מִשּׁוּם גִּילּוּי. וְכַמָּה תְּסִיסָתוֹ? שְׁלֹשָׁה יָמִים.
human_translation: And wine from his press until when As long as it is fermenting. And it is taught Fermenting wine is not subject to exposed And how long its fermenting Three days
llm_translation: Wine from its pressing, until when? As long as it is fermenting. And it was taught: Wine that is fermenting does not have the status of revelation. And how long is its fermentation? Three days.

hebrew_text: הָכָא מַאי? הָתָם מִשּׁוּם שִׂמְחָה הוּא, כׇּל זְמַן שֶׁהוּא כִּשְׁלָמִים נָמֵי אִית בֵּיהּ שִׂמְחָה. הָכָא מִשּׁוּם אִימְּשׁוֹכֵי הוּא, וּבְכָל שֶׁהוּא לָא מִימְּשִׁיךְ. וְיַיִן – עַד אַרְבָּעִים יוֹם.
human_translation: Here, what There, is due to joy; as long as is like a peace offering, there is still joy. here, it is due to becoming drawn and slightly he will not be drawn And wine, until forty days
llm_translation: Here what? There because joy it, all time that he peace offerings stand in it joy. Here because it spoils it, and in all that it does not spoil. And wine - up to forty days.
