hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חָנָן: לֹא נִבְרָא יַיִן בָּעוֹלָם אֶלָּא לְנַחֵם אֲבֵלִים, וּלְשַׁלֵּם שָׂכָר לָרְשָׁעִים, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״תְּנוּ שֵׁכָר לְאוֹבֵד וְיַיִן לְמָרֵי נָפֶשׁ״.
human_translation: Rav Ḥanan says: Wine was created in the world only to comfort mourners and to reward the wicked as it is stated: “Give strong drink to him that is ready to perish, and wine to the bitter of soul”
llm_translation: Rav Hanan said: Wine was not created in the world except to comfort mourners and to pay the reward to the wicked, as it is stated: "Give strong drink to him who is perishing, and wine to those who are bitter of soul."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: מַאי דִּכְתִיב ״אַל תֵּרֶא יַיִן כִּי יִתְאַדָּם״? אַל תֵּרֶא יַיִן שֶׁמַּאֲדִים פְּנֵיהֶם שֶׁל רְשָׁעִים בָּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה, וּמַלְבִּין פְּנֵיהֶם לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא. רָבָא אָמַר: ״אַל תֵּרֶא יַיִן כִּי יִתְאַדָּם״ – אַל תֵּרֶא יַיִן שֶׁאַחֲרִיתוֹ דָּם.
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzḥak says: What which is written: “Look not upon wine when it is red” Look not upon wine that reddens the faces of the wicked in this world and whitens their faces, in the World-to-Come. Rava says “Look not upon wine that reddens [ yitaddam ]” Look not upon wine, as it leads to bloodshed [ dam ],
llm_translation: Rabbi Yitzchak said: What is the meaning of the verse, "Do not look at wine when it is red"? Do not look at wine that reddens the faces of the wicked in this world, but whitens their faces in the world to come. Rava said: "Do not look at wine when it is red" - do not look at wine whose end is blood.

hebrew_text: רַב כָּהֲנָא רָמֵי: כְּתִיב ״תִּירָשׁ״ וְקָרֵינַן ״תִּירוֹשׁ״. זָכָה – נַעֲשֶׂה רֹאשׁ, לֹא זָכָה – נַעֲשֶׂה רָשׁ.
human_translation: Rav Kahana raises a contradiction: is written tirash , but we read tirosh , one merits he becomes a leader [ rosh ], he does not merit he becomes poor [ rash ].
llm_translation: Rav Kahana raises a contradiction: It is written "tirash" but we read it as "tirosh." If one merits, he will become a leader; if he does not merit, he will become poor.

hebrew_text: רָבָא רָמֵי: כְּתִיב ״יְשַׁמַּח״ וְקָרֵינַן ״יְשַׂמַּח״. זָכָה – מְשַׂמְּחוֹ, לֹא זָכָה – מְשַׁמְּמֵהוּ. וְהַיְינוּ דְּאָמַר רָבָא: חַמְרָא וְרֵיחָנֵי פַּקַּחִין.
human_translation: Rava raises contradiction: is written: gladdens but we read yesamaḥ , one merits gladdens him [ mesameḥo ], he does not merit it makes him crazy [ meshamemehu ]. And that is what Rava said: Wine and spices have made me wise;
llm_translation: Rava raises an objection: It is written "yismach" (he shall rejoice), and we read it as "yismach" (he shall make rejoice). If one merits it, he makes others rejoice; if he does not merit it, he causes them to be desolate. And this is what Rava said: Wine and fragrant spices make one's mind open.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב עַמְרָם בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בַּר אַבָּא, אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: מַאי דִּכְתִיב ״לְמִי אוֹי לְמִי אֲבוֹי לְמִי מְדָנִים לְמִי שִׂיחַ לְמִי פְּצָעִים חִנָּם לְמִי חַכְלִלוּת עֵינָיִם (וְגוֹ׳) לַמְאַחֲרִים עַל הַיָּיִן לַבָּאִים לַחְקֹר מִמְסָךְ״? כִּי אֲתָא רַב דִּימִי אֲמַר: אָמְרִי בְּמַעְרְבָא, הַאי קְרָא מַאן דְּדָרֵישׁ לֵיהּ מֵרֵישֵׁיהּ לְסֵיפֵיהּ – מִדְּרִישׁ, וּמִסֵּיפֵיהּ לְרֵישֵׁיהּ – מִדְּרִישׁ.
human_translation: Rav Amram, son of Rabbi Shimon bar Abba, says Rabbi Ḥanina says: What which is written: “Who cries, Woe? Who cries, Alas? Who has quarrels? Who has complaints? Who has causeless injuries? Who has redness of eyes? They who tarry long at the wine, they who go to seek mixed wine” When Rav Dimi came he said they say in the West, one who interprets this verse from the beginning to the end interprets And from the end to the beginning interprets
llm_translation: Rav Amram, son of Rabbi Shimon bar Abba, said: Rabbi Chanina said: What is the meaning of what is written, "To whom woe, to whom sorrow, to whom contentions, to whom complaints, to whom wounds without cause, to whom redness of eyes? Those who tarry long at the wine, those who go to seek mixed wine" (Proverbs 23:29-30)? When Rav Dimi came, he said: They say in the West, one who interprets it from its beginning to its end - let him interpret, and one who interprets it from its end to its beginning - let him interpret.

hebrew_text: דָּרֵישׁ עוֹבֵר גָּלִילָאָה: שְׁלֹשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה וָוִין נֶאֱמַר בַּיַּיִן: ״וַיָּחֶל נֹחַ אִישׁ הָאֲדָמָה, וַיִּטַּע כָּרֶם, וַיֵּשְׁתְּ מִן הַיַּיִן, וַיִּשְׁכָּר, וַיִּתְגַּל בְּתוֹךְ אׇהֳלוֹ, וַיַּרְא חָם אֲבִי כְנַעַן אֵת עֶרְוַת אָבִיו, וַיַּגֵּד לִשְׁנֵי אֶחָיו בַּחוּץ, וַיִּקַּח שֵׁם וָיֶפֶת אֶת הַשִּׂמְלָה, וַיָּשִׂימוּ עַל שְׁכֶם שְׁנֵיהֶם, וַיֵּלְכוּ אֲחֹרַנִּית, וַיְכַסּוּ אֵת עֶרְוַת אֲבִיהֶם וּפְנֵיהֶם וְגוֹ׳״, ״וַיִּיקֶץ נֹחַ מִיֵּינוֹ, וַיֵּדַע אֵת אֲשֶׁר עָשָׂה לוֹ בְּנוֹ הַקָּטָן״.
human_translation: A visitor from the Galilee expounded: The vav is stated thirteen in wine, “And Noah began [ vayyaḥel ] to be a farmer, and he planted [ vayyita ] a vineyard, and he drank [ vayyesht ] of the wine, and was drunk [ vayyishkar ]; and he was uncovered [ vayyitgal ] within his tent. And Ham, the father of Canaan, saw [ vayyar ] the nakedness of his father, and told [ vayyagged ] his two brothers outside. And Shem and Japheth took [ vayyikaḥ ] the garment, and laid it [ vayyasimu ] upon both their shoulders, and went [ vayyelekhu ] backward, and covered [ vaykhassu ] the nakedness of their father; and their faces And Noah awoke [ vayyiketz ] from his wine, and knew [ vayyeda ] what his younger son had done to him”
llm_translation: The seeker who passed through Galilee: Thirteen "vav" connective words are mentioned in connection with wine: "And Noah began to be a man of the soil, and he planted a vineyard. And he drank of the wine and became drunk, and he uncovered himself within his tent. And Ham, the father of Canaan, saw the nakedness of his father, and he told his two brothers outside. And Shem and Japheth took the garment and placed it upon both their shoulders, and they walked backward, and covered the nakedness of their father, and their faces, etc." "And Noah awoke from his wine, and he knew what his youngest son had done to him."

hebrew_text: רַב וּשְׁמוּאֵל: חַד אָמַר סֵרְסוֹ, וְחַד אָמַר רְבָעוֹ.
human_translation: Rav and Shmuel One says castrated and one says sodomized him.
llm_translation: Rav and Shmuel: one said "serso," and one said "revao."

hebrew_text: מַאן דְּאָמַר סֵרְסוֹ: מִתּוֹךְ שֶׁקִּלְקְלוֹ בָּרְבִיעִי, קִלְּלוֹ בָּרְבִיעִי. וּמַאן דְּאָמַר רְבָעוֹ: גָּמַר ״וַיַּרְא״ ״וַיַּרְא״. כְּתִיב הָכָא: ״וַיַּרְא חָם אֲבִי כְנַעַן אֵת עֶרְוַת אָבִיו״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם: ״וַיַּרְא אוֹתָהּ שְׁכֶם בֶּן חֲמוֹר וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: The one who says castrated Since he injured with a fourth cursed him by means of fourth son. And the one who says sodomized learned “and he saw” “and he saw.” Here it is written: “And Ham, the father of Canaan, saw the nakedness of his father”; and there it is written: “And Shechem, son of Hamor saw her,
llm_translation: The one who says "Serso": Because he sinned on the fourth day, he was cursed on the fourth day. And the one who says "Reva'o": He completed the verse "and he saw," "and he saw." It is written here: "And Ham, the father of Canaan, saw the nakedness of his father," and it is written there: "And Shechem the son of Hamor saw her, etc."

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר סֵרְסוֹ, מִשּׁוּם הָכִי קִלְּלוֹ בָּרְבִיעִי. אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר רְבָעוֹ, מַאי שְׁנָא רְבִיעִי? נִלְטְיֵיהּ בְּהֶדְיָא! הָא וְהָא הֲוַאי.
human_translation: Granted, according to the one who says castrated due to that cursed by means of fourth But according to the one who says sodomized him, what is different fourth He should have cursed directly. this and that were
llm_translation: In peace, according to the one who said "Serso," therefore they cursed him on the fourth day. Rather, according to the one who said "Reva'o," what is different about the fourth day? Let him go with his hand! This and that should be.

hebrew_text: ״וַיָּחֶל נֹחַ אִישׁ הָאֲדָמָה וַיִּטַּע כָּרֶם״. אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא אָמַר רַב עוּקְבָא, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ מָר עוּקְבָא אָמַר רַבִּי זַכַּאי: אָמַר לוֹ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לְנֹחַ: נֹחַ, לֹא הָיָה לְךָ לִלְמוֹד מֵאָדָם הָרִאשׁוֹן שֶׁלֹּא גָּרַם לוֹ אֶלָּא יַיִן? כְּמַאן דְּאָמַר אוֹתוֹ אִילָן שֶׁאָכַל מִמֶּנּוּ אָדָם הָרִאשׁוֹן – גֶּפֶן הָיָה.
human_translation: “And Noah began to be a farmer, and he planted a vineyard.” Rav Ḥisda says Rav Ukva says, and some say Mar Ukva says Rabbi Zakkai says: The Holy One, Blessed be He, said to Noah: Noah, shouldn’t you have learned from Adam the first whose was caused only by wine? in accordance with the one who says the tree from which Adam the first ate was a grapevine.
llm_translation: "And Noach began, a man of the soil, and planted a vineyard." Rav Chisda said in the name of Rav Ukva, and some say it was Mar Ukva who said in the name of Rabbi Zakkai: The Holy One, blessed be He, said to Noach: Noach, you should not have learned from the first man, who was caused to sin only by wine? As it is said, the tree from which the first man ate – it was a vine."

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר, אוֹתוֹ אִילָן שֶׁאָכַל אָדָם הָרִאשׁוֹן מִמֶּנּוּ – גֶּפֶן הָיָה,
human_translation: As it is taught Rabbi Meir says: The tree from which Adam the first ate was a grapevine,
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi Meir says, that same tree from which the first man ate - it was a vine.

hebrew_text: שֶׁאֵין לְךָ דָּבָר שֶׁמֵּבִיא יְלָלָה לְאָדָם אֶלָּא יַיִן. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: חִטָּה הָיָה, שֶׁאֵין הַתִּינוֹק יוֹדֵעַ לִקְרוֹא אַבָּא וְאֵימָא עַד שֶׁיִּטְעוֹם טַעַם דָּגָן. רַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה אוֹמֵר: תְּאֵנָה הָיָה, שֶׁבַּדָּבָר שֶׁקִּלְקְלוּ בּוֹ נִתְקְנוּ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיִּתְפְּרוּ עֲלֵה תְאֵנָה״.
human_translation: as, nothing except wine brings wailing upon a person; Rabbi Yehuda says: was wheat that, an infant does not know how to call out father or mother until he tastes the taste of grain, Rabbi Neḥemya says: was a fig because with the matter with which they sinned they were rehabilitated, as it is stated: “And they sewed together fig leaves,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "That you have nothing that brings wailing to a person except wine. Rabbi Yehudah says: It was wheat, for the infant does not know how to say 'father' and 'mother' until he tastes the taste of grain. Rabbi Nechemyah says: It was a fig, for with the thing that they sinned with, they were rectified, as it is said: 'And they sewed fig leaves together.'"

hebrew_text: ״דִּבְרֵי לְמוּאֵל מֶלֶךְ מַשָּׂא אֲשֶׁר יִסְּרַתּוּ אִמּוֹ״. אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַי: מְלַמֵּד שֶׁכְּפָאַתּוּ אִמּוֹ עַל הָעַמּוּד וְאָמְרָה לוֹ, ״מַה בְּרִי וּמַה בַּר בִּטְנִי וּמֶה בַּר נְדָרָי״. ״מַה בְּרִי״ – הַכֹּל יוֹדְעִים שֶׁאָבִיךְ יְרֵא שָׁמַיִם הֲוָה, עַכְשָׁיו יֹאמְרוּ אִמּוֹ גָּרְמָה לוֹ.
human_translation: “The words of King Lemuel, the burden with which his mother corrected him” Rabbi Yoḥanan says in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai: teaches that mother bound him to a pillar And she said to him: “What, my son? And what, son of my womb? And what, son of my vows?” “What, my son?” Everyone knows that your father, was a God-fearing now, they will say his mother caused him
llm_translation: "Words of Lemuel, king, a burden that his mother disciplined him." Rabbi Yochanan said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai: It teaches that his mother slapped him on the pillar and said to him, "What, my son, and what, son of my womb, and what, son of my vows." "What, my son" – everyone knows that your father was God-fearing, now they say that his mother caused him.

hebrew_text: ״וּמַה בַּר בִּטְנִי״ – כׇּל הַנָּשִׁים שֶׁל בֵּית אָבִיךָ, כֵּיוָן שֶׁמִּתְעַבְּרוֹת, שׁוּב אֵינָן רוֹאוֹת פְּנֵי הַמֶּלֶךְ. וַאֲנִי דָּחַקְתִּי וְנִכְנַסְתִּי, כְּדֵי שֶׁיְּהֵא לִי בֵּן מְזוֹרָז וּמְלוּבָּן.
human_translation: “And what, son of my womb?” all of the women of your father’s house, once they conceive they no longer see the face of the king, but I pushed and entered so that I might have a son who is strong and fair-skinned.
llm_translation: "Uma bar Bitni" - all the women of your father's house, once they become pregnant, they no longer see the face of the king. And I have pressed and entered, so that I may have a son who is well-fed and well-clothed.

hebrew_text: ״וּמָה בַּר נְדָרָי״ – כָּל נָשִׁים שֶׁל בֵּית אָבִיךָ הָיוּ נוֹדְרוֹת: ״יְהֵא לִי בֵּן הָגוּן לַמַּלְכוּת״, וַאֲנִי נָדַרְתִּי וְאָמַרְתִּי: ״יְהֵא לִי בֵּן זָרִיז וּמְמוּלָּא בַּתּוֹרָה וְהָגוּן לִנְבִיאוּת״.
human_translation: “And what, son of my vows?” all of women of your father’s house, they would take vows Let me have a son who is fit to be king. But I, took a vow and said: Let me have a son who is diligent and filled with the Torah and fit for prophecy.
llm_translation: "Uma bar Nedarai" - all women of your father's household were making vows: "May I have a son suitable for the kingdom," and I vowed and said: "May I have a son diligent and filled with Torah knowledge and suitable for prophecy."

hebrew_text: ״אַל לַמְלָכִים לְמוֹאֵל, אַל לַמְלָכִים שְׁתוֹ יָיִן״. ״אַל לַמְלָכִים״ – אָמְרָה לוֹ: מָה לְךָ אֵצֶל מְלָכִים שֶׁשּׁוֹתִים יַיִן וּמִשְׁתַּכְּרִים וְאוֹמְרִים לָמָּה לָנוּ אֵל? ״וּלְרוֹזְנִים אֵי שֵׁכָר״ – מִי שֶׁכׇּל רָזֵי עוֹלָם גְּלוּיִים לוֹ יִשְׁתֶּה יַיִן וְיִשְׁתַּכֵּר? אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: מִי שֶׁכׇּל רוֹזְנֵי עוֹלָם מַשְׁכִּימִין לְפִתְחוֹ יִשְׁתֶּה יַיִן וְיִשְׁתַּכֵּר?
human_translation: “It is not for kings, O Lemoel, it is not for kings to drink wine; “It is not for kings”: said to What have you to do with kings who drink wine and become intoxicated and say: Why [ lamma ] do we need God [ El ]? “Nor for princes [ rozenim ] to say: Where is strong drink?” one to whom all the secrets [ razei ] of the world are revealed, should he drink wine and become intoxicated? there are who say One to whom all the princes of the world rise early to his door, should he drink wine and become intoxicated?
llm_translation: "Al lam'lakhim le'Moel, al lam'lakhim shto yayin." "Al lam'lakhim" - she said to him: What is it to you with kings who drink wine and become intoxicated and say, 'Why do we need God?' "U'leroznim ei shechar" - if one knows all the secrets of the world, should he drink wine and become intoxicated? Some say: If one knows all the secrets of the world, he should drink wine early in the morning and become intoxicated.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: מִנַּיִין שֶׁחָזַר שְׁלֹמֹה וְהוֹדָה לְאִמּוֹ? דִּכְתִיב: ״כִּי בַעַר אָנֹכִי מֵאִישׁ וְלֹא בִינַת אָדָם לִי״. ״כִּי בַעַר אָנֹכִי מֵאִישׁ״ – מִנֹּחַ, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיָּחֶל נֹחַ אִישׁ הָאֲדָמָה״. ״וְלֹא בִינַת אָדָם לִי״ – זֶה אָדָם הָרִאשׁוֹן.
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzḥak says: From where that Solomon repented and admitted to his mother As it is written: “For I am more foolish than a man, and have not the understanding of a man” “For I am more foolish than a man [ ish ]”; as it is written: “And Noah began to be a farmer [ ish ha’adama “And have not the understanding of a man [ adam ]”; this Adam the first
llm_translation: Rabbi Yitzchak said: From where do we derive that Shlomo returned and acknowledged his mother? As it is written: "For I am more brutish than any man, and have not the understanding of a man." "For I am more brutish than any man" – this refers to Noach, as it is written: "And Noach began to be a man of the soil." "And have not the understanding of a man" – this is referring to Adam the first man.

hebrew_text: אָכַל בַּחֲבוּרַת מִצְוָה. אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב עַד שֶׁיֹּאכַל בַּחֲבוּרָה שֶׁכּוּלָּהּ סְרִיקִין.
human_translation: ate with a group of a mitzva, Rabbi Abbahu says: He is not liable unless he eats with a group that is entirely idlers.
llm_translation: He ate with a group of people performing a commandment. Rabbi Avahu said: He is not liable until he eats with a group whose entire membership are scribes.

hebrew_text: וְהָאֲנַן תְּנַן: אָכַל בַּחֲבוּרַת מִצְוָה – אֵינוֹ נַעֲשֶׂה בֵּן סוֹרֵר וּמוֹרֶה. טַעְמָא דְּמִצְוָה, הָא לָאו מִצְוָה – אַף עַל גַּב דְּלָאו כּוּלָּהּ סְרִיקִין? הָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן: דְּאַף עַל גַּב דְּכוּלָּהּ סְרִיקִין, כֵּיוָן דִּבְמִצְוָה קָא עָסֵיק – לָא מִימְּשִׁיךְ.
human_translation: But didn’t we learn ate with a group of a mitzva he does not become a stubborn and rebellious son? the reason of a mitzva. But not a mitzva even if is not entirely idlers. teaches us this: That even if is entirely idlers, since they are occupied with a mitzva, no will be drawn
llm_translation: We have learned: One who eats in a group performing a commandment - he does not become a rebellious son and a stubborn one. The reason for a commandment, this is not a commandment - even though it is not entirely removed? This teaches us: that even though it is not entirely removed, since he is engaged in a commandment - he does not continue.

hebrew_text: אָכַל בְּעִיבּוּר הַחוֹדֶשׁ. לְמֵימְרָא דְּבָשָׂר וְיַיִן מַסְּקוּ? וְהָתַנְיָא: אֵין עוֹלִין לָהּ אֶלָּא בְּפַת דָּגָן וְקִטְנִית בִּלְבַד! הָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן: אַף עַל גַּב דְּאֵין עוֹלִין לָהּ אֶלָּא בְּפַת וְקִטְנִית, וְאִיהוּ אַסֵּיק בָּשָׂר וְיַיִן וַאֲכַל, כֵּיוָן דִּבְמִצְוָה קָא עָסֵיק – לָא מִמְּשִׁיךְ.
human_translation: ate at the intercalation of the month Is this to say that meat and wine are brought up But isn’t it taught They ascend only with bread grain and legumes? teaches us this: Even though they ascend to only with bread and legumes, and he brought up meat and wine and ate since they are occupied with a mitzva, no will be drawn
llm_translation: He ate on the eve of the new month. Is it to be inferred that he ate meat and wine? But it was taught: One may only go up to her with bread, grain, and a small amount of cooked food! This teaches us: Even though one may only go up to her with bread and a small amount of cooked food, and he brought meat and wine and ate, since he was engaged in a mitzvah - he does not continue.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אֵין עוֹלִין בְּעִיבּוּר הַחוֹדֶשׁ פָּחוֹת מֵעֲשָׂרָה בְּנֵי אָדָם, וְאֵין עוֹלִין לָהּ אֶלָּא בְּפַת דָּגָן וְקִטְנִית, וְאֵין עוֹלִין לָהּ אֶלָּא לְאוֹר עִיבּוּרוֹ, וְאֵין עוֹלִין לָהּ בַּיּוֹם אֶלָּא בַּלַּיְלָה. וְהָתַנְיָא: אֵין עוֹלִין לָהּ בַּלַּיְלָה אֶלָּא בַּיּוֹם! כְּדַאֲמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא לִבְנֵיהּ: אַחְרִיפוּ וְעוּלוּ, אַחְרִיפוּ וּפוּקוּ, כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלִישְׁמְעוּ בְּכוּ אִינָשֵׁי.
human_translation: The Sages taught No fewer than ten men ascend for the intercalation of the month; and they ascend only with bread grain and legumes; and they ascend only on the night of intercalation; and they ascend not by day, but only at night. But isn’t it taught They ascend not at night, but only by day? As Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba said to his sons: ascend early and leave early so that people should hear your
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: One may not ascend to Jerusalem for the New Moon festival with fewer than ten people, and they may only ascend with bread made from wheat and beer. They may only ascend with the light of its the moon's appearance, and they may only ascend at night. And it was taught: They may only ascend at night, not during the day! As Rabbi Hiyya bar Abba said to his sons: Hurry and ascend, hurry and depart, so that people may hear about you.

hebrew_text: אָכַל מַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם. כֵּיוָן דְּכִי אוֹרְחֵיהּ הוּא קָא אָכֵיל לֵיהּ, לָא מִמְּשִׁיךְ.
human_translation: ate second tithe in Jerusalem Since he eats in the normal way, he will not be drawn
llm_translation: He ate second tithe in Jerusalem. Since he is eating it as he walks, he does not need to stop.

hebrew_text: אָכַל נְבֵילוֹת וּטְרֵיפוֹת, שְׁקָצִים וּרְמָשִׂים. אָמַר רָבָא: אָכַל בְּשַׂר עוֹף – אֵינוֹ נַעֲשֶׂה בֵּן סוֹרֵר וּמוֹרֶה.
human_translation: ate animal carcasses or tereifot repugnant creatures or creeping animals, Rava says: ate the meat of fowl, he does not become a stubborn and rebellious son.
llm_translation: He ate neveilahs and tereifahs, abominations and creeping things. Rava said: If one eats the flesh of a bird, he does not become a rebellious son and a stubborn one.

hebrew_text: וְהָא אֲנַן תְּנַן: אָכַל נְבֵילוֹת וּטְרֵיפוֹת, שְׁקָצִים וּרְמָשִׂים – אֵינוֹ נַעֲשֶׂה בֵּן סוֹרֵר וּמוֹרֶה. הָא טְהוֹרִין – נַעֲשֶׂה בֵּן סוֹרֵר וּמוֹרֶה? כִּי תְּנַן נָמֵי מַתְנִיתִין – לְהַשְׁלִים.
human_translation: But didn’t we learn ate animal carcasses or tereifot repugnant creatures or creeping animals, he does not become a stubborn and rebellious son? but kosher he would become a stubborn and rebellious son, When we learned the mishna as well, to completing
llm_translation: And we learned in a Mishnah: One who eats neveilahs, treifahs, sheretzim, and remasim - he does not become a rebellious son and a rebellious elder. But with regard to pure things - does he become a rebellious son and a rebellious elder? For we also learned in a Mishnah - to complete.

hebrew_text: אָכַל דָּבָר שֶׁהוּא מִצְוָה, וּדְבַר עֲבֵירָה. דְּבַר מִצְוָה – תַּנְחוּמֵי אֲבֵלִים, דְּבַר עֲבֵירָה – תַּעֲנִית צִיבּוּר.
human_translation: he ate an item that a mitzva or an item a transgression, an item a mitzva comforting mourners. an item a transgression communal fast.
llm_translation: He ate a matter that is a commandment, and a matter that is a transgression. A matter of commandment - comforting mourners, a matter of transgression - communal fast.

hebrew_text: וְטַעְמָא מַאי? אָמַר קְרָא: ״אֵינֶנּוּ שֹׁמֵעַ בְּקֹלֵנוּ״ – בְּקוֹלֵנוּ, וְלֹא בְּקוֹלוֹ שֶׁל מָקוֹם.
human_translation: And what the reason The verse states: he will not obey our voices” “our voices,” but not the voice of God.
llm_translation: The reason what? Said the verse: "He does not listen to our voice" - to our voice, and not to the voice of the Omnipresent.

hebrew_text: אָכַל כׇּל מַאֲכָל וְלֹא אָכַל בָּשָׂר, שָׁתָה כׇּל מַשְׁקֶה וְלֹא שָׁתָה יַיִן וְכוּ׳. אָכַל כׇּל מַאֲכָל וְלֹא אָכַל בָּשָׂר – לְאֵיתוֹיֵי דְּבֵילָה קְעִילִית. שָׁתָה כׇּל מַשְׁקֶה וְלֹא שָׁתָה יַיִן – לְאֵיתוֹיֵי דְּבַשׁ וְחָלָב.
human_translation: ate any food but did not eat meat, he drank any beverage but did not drink wine, he ate any food but did not eat meat, comes to include figs from Ke’ila, he drank any beverage but did not drink wine, comes to include honey and milk,
llm_translation: He ate all food and did not eat meat, he drank all beverages and did not drink wine, etc. He ate all food and did not eat meat - to avoid the appearance of gluttony. He drank all beverages and did not drink wine - to avoid the appearance of indulging in honey and milk.

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: אָכַל דְּבֵילָה קְעִילִית, וְשָׁתָה דְּבַשׁ וְחָלָב, וְנִכְנַס לַמִּקְדָּשׁ –
human_translation: As it is taught ate figs from Ke’ila, or drank honey or milk, and he entered the Temple
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: One who ate a kezayit of a neveilah, and drank honey and milk, and entered the Temple -

hebrew_text: חַיָּיב.
human_translation: liable
llm_translation: Guilty.

hebrew_text: אֵינוֹ נַעֲשֶׂה בֵּן סוֹרֵר וּמוֹרֶה עַד שֶׁיֹּאכַל בָּשָׂר וְיִשְׁתֶּה יַיִן. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אָכַל כׇּל מַאֲכָל וְלֹא אָכַל בָּשָׂר, שָׁתָה כׇּל מַשְׁקֶה וְלֹא שָׁתָה יַיִן – אֵינוֹ נַעֲשֶׂה בֵּן סוֹרֵר וּמוֹרֶה עַד שֶׁיֹּאכַל בָּשָׂר וְיִשְׁתֶּה יַיִן, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״זוֹלֵל וְסֹבֵא״.
human_translation: does not become a stubborn and rebellious son unless he eats meat and drinks wine. The Sages taught he ate any food but did not eat meat, he drank any beverage but did not drink wine, he does not become a stubborn and rebellious son unless he eats meat and drinks wine, as it is stated: a glutton and a drunkard.”
llm_translation: The son of a stubborn and rebellious one is not made until he eats meat and drinks wine. The Rabbis taught: If he ate all types of food but did not eat meat, and drank all types of beverages but did not drink wine - he is not made a stubborn and rebellious son until he eats meat and drinks wine, as it is stated: "He is a glutton and a drunkard."

hebrew_text: וְאַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין רְאָיָיה לַדָּבָר, זֵכֶר לַדָּבָר שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אַל תְּהִי בְסֹבְאֵי יָיִן בְּזֹלְלֵי בָשָׂר לָמוֹ״, וְאוֹמֵר: ״כִּי סֹבֵא וְזוֹלֵל יִוָּרֵשׁ וּקְרָעִים תַּלְבִּישׁ נוּמָה״. אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: כׇּל הַיָּשֵׁן בְּבֵית הַמִּדְרָשׁ תּוֹרָתוֹ נַעֲשֵׂית לוֹ קְרָעִים קְרָעִים, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּקְרָעִים תַּלְבִּישׁ נוּמָה״.
human_translation: And although there is no proof to the matter, an allusion to the matter as it is stated: “Be not among wine drinkers, among gluttonous eaters of meat” And states: “For the drunkard and the glutton shall come to poverty, and drowsiness shall clothe a man with rags” Rabbi Zeira says: anyone who sleeps in the study hall, his Torah shall become tattered, as it is stated: “And drowsiness shall clothe a man with rags.”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And even though there is no visible proof for the matter, a remembrance for the matter as it is stated: 'Do not be among the drinkers of wine, among the gluttonous eaters of meat,' and it also says: 'For the drunkard and the glutton shall come to poverty, and drowsiness shall clothe a man with rags.' Rabbi Zeira said: Anyone who sleeps in the study hall, his Torah becomes torn, torn, as it is stated: 'And drowsiness shall clothe a man with rags.'"

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ גָּנַב מִשֶּׁל אָבִיו וְאָכַל בִּרְשׁוּת אָבִיו, מִשֶּׁל אֲחֵרִים וְאָכַל בִּרְשׁוּת אֲחֵרִים, מִשֶּׁל אֲחֵרִים וְאָכַל בִּרְשׁוּת אָבִיו – אֵינוֹ נַעֲשֶׂה בֵּן סוֹרֵר וּמוֹרֶה עַד שֶׁיִּגְנוֹב מִשֶּׁל אָבִיו וְיֹאכַל בִּרְשׁוּת אֲחֵרִים. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: עַד שֶׁיִּגְנוֹב מִשֶּׁל אָבִיו וּמִשֶּׁל אִמּוֹ.
human_translation: he stole that to his father and ate on his father’s property, to others and ate on the property of others, to others and ate on his father’s property, he does not become a stubborn and rebellious son, unless he steals to his father and eats on the property of others. Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: unless he steals to his father and to his mother.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: If one steals from his father and eats in his father's domain, or if he steals from others and eats in their domain, or if he steals from others and eats in his father's domain - he does not become a rebellious son and a glutton until he steals from his father and eats in others' domain. Rabbi Yosei, the son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: Until he steals from his father and mother.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ גָּנַב מִשֶּׁל אָבִיו וְאָכַל בִּרְשׁוּת אָבִיו. אַף עַל גַּב דִּשְׁכִיחַ לֵיהּ, בְּעִית.
human_translation: he stole to his father and ate on his father’s property, even though this is accessible to him he is afraid
llm_translation: Theft stole from his father and ate with the permission of his father. Even though it is common for him, it is forbidden.

hebrew_text: מִשֶּׁל אֲחֵרִים וְאָכַל בִּרְשׁוּת אֲחֵרִים. אַף עַל גַּב דְּלָא בְּעִית – לָא שְׁכִיחַ לֵיהּ. וְכׇל שֶׁכֵּן מִשֶּׁל אֲחֵרִים וְאָכַל בִּרְשׁוּת אָבִיו, דְּלָא שְׁכִיחַ לֵיהּ וּבְעִית.
human_translation: to others and ate on the property of others, even though he is not afraid is not accessible to him, And all the more so to others and ate on his father’s property, which it is not accessible to him, and he is afraid
llm_translation: From the property of others and ate with the permission of others. Even though he did not desire - it is not common for him. And certainly from the property of others and ate with the permission of his father, which is not common for him and he desired.

hebrew_text: עַד שֶׁיִּגְנוֹב מִשֶּׁל אָבִיו, וְיֹאכַל בִּרְשׁוּת אֲחֵרִים. דִּשְׁכִיחַ לֵיהּ, וְלָא בְּעִית.
human_translation: unless he steals to his father and eats on the property of others, which it is accessible to him, and he is not afraid,
llm_translation: Until he steals from his father's property, and eats with the permission of others. It is common for him, and not by force.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: עַד שֶׁיִּגְנוֹב מִשֶּׁל אָבִיו וּמִשֶּׁל אִמּוֹ. אִמּוֹ מְנָא לַהּ? מַה שֶּׁקָּנְתָה אִשָּׁה קָנָה בַּעְלָהּ! אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: מִסְּעוּדָה הַמּוּכֶנֶת לְאָבִיו וּלְאִמּוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says unless he steals to his father and to his mother. his mother, from where does she have anything that a woman acquires is acquired by her husband. Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, says from a meal that had been prepared for his father and for his mother.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: Until he steals from his father's property and his mother's property. How does he steal from his mother? Whatever a woman acquires, her husband acquires! Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Chanina, said: From the prepared meal for his father and his mother.

hebrew_text: וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי חָנָן בַּר מוֹלָדָה אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב עַד שֶׁיִּקְנֶה בָּשָׂר בְּזוֹל וְיֹאכַל, יַיִן בְּזוֹל וְיִשְׁתֶּה? אֶלָּא, אֵימָא: מִדְּמֵי סְעוּדָה הַמּוּכֶנֶת לְאָבִיו וּלְאִמּוֹ.
human_translation: But doesn’t Rabbi Ḥanan bar Molada say Rav Huna says: is not liable unless he purchases inexpensive meat and eats inexpensive wine and drinks Rather, say from money for a meal that was to be prepared for his father and for his mother.
llm_translation: And he said, Rabbi Hanan bar Moladah said Rav Huna: He is not liable until he acquires meat at a low price and eats, wine at a low price and drinks? Rather, say: From the value of a meal prepared for his father and mother.

hebrew_text: אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: דְּאַקְנִי לַהּ אַחֵר, וַאֲמַר לַהּ: ״עַל מְנָת שֶׁאֵין לְבַעְלִיךְ רְשׁוּת בָּהֶן״.
human_translation: If you wish, say that another gave to and said to her: on the condition that your husband shall have no right to it.
llm_translation: If you wish, say: that he acquires for her another, and he says to her: "On the condition that your husband has no rights in them."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הָיָה אָבִיו רוֹצֶה וְאִמּוֹ אֵינָהּ רוֹצֶה, אָבִיו אֵינוֹ רוֹצֶה וְאִמּוֹ רוֹצָה – אֵינוֹ נַעֲשֶׂה בֵּן סוֹרֵר וּמוֹרֶה עַד שֶׁיְּהוּ שְׁנֵיהֶם רוֹצִין. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אִם לֹא הָיְתָה אִמּוֹ רְאוּיָה לְאָבִיו, אֵינוֹ נַעֲשֶׂה בֵּן סוֹרֵר וּמוֹרֶה.
human_translation: his father wishes but his mother does not wish his father does not wish but his mother wishes he does not become a stubborn and rebellious son, unless they both wish Rabbi Yehuda says: If his mother was not suited for his father, he does not become a stubborn and rebellious son.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If his father desires and his mother does not desire, if his father does not desire and his mother desires - he does not become a rebellious son and a stubborn son until both of them desire. Rabbi Yehuda says: If his mother was not fitting for his father, he does not become a rebellious son and a stubborn son.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי ״אֵינָהּ רְאוּיָה״? אִילֵּימָא חַיָּיבֵי כָרֵיתוֹת וְחַיָּיבֵי מִיתוֹת בֵּית דִּין, סוֹף סוֹף אֲבוּהּ אֲבוּהּ נִיהוּ, וְאִמֵּיהּ אִמֵּיהּ נִיהִי!
human_translation: What not suited If we say those who are liable to karet , and those who are liable to court- death Ultimately, his father is his father and his mother is his mother,
llm_translation: Gemara: What is the meaning of "einah reuyah"? If you will say, those liable to karet and those liable to death by the court, ultimately, his father is his father, and his mother is his mother!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא בְּשָׁוָה לְאָבִיו קָאָמַר. תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר, אִם לֹא הָיְתָה אִמּוֹ שָׁוָה לְאָבִיו בְּקוֹל וּבְמַרְאֶה וּבַקּוֹמָה, אֵינוֹ נַעֲשֶׂה בֵּן סוֹרֵר וּמוֹרֶה. מַאי טַעְמָא? דְּאָמַר קְרָא ״אֵינֶנּוּ שֹׁמֵעַ בְּקֹלֵנוּ״. מִדְּקוֹל בָּעֵינַן שָׁוִין, מַרְאֶה וְקוֹמָה נָמֵי בָּעֵינַן שָׁוִין.
human_translation: Rather, is saying identical to his father This is also taught Rabbi Yehuda says: If his mother was not identical to his father in voice, appearance, and height, he does not become a stubborn and rebellious son. What is the reason As the verse states: “He will not obey our voices kolenu since we require identical voice, we also require identical appearance and height.
llm_translation: Rather, he meant that he is similar to his father. It was taught similarly: Rabbi Yehuda says, if his mother was not similar to his father in voice, appearance, and stature, he does not become a rebellious son. What is the reason? As the verse says, "he does not listen to our voice." Just as we require similarity in voice, we also require similarity in appearance and stature.

hebrew_text: כְּמַאן אָזְלָא הָא דְּתַנְיָא: בֵּן סוֹרֵר וּמוֹרֶה לֹא הָיָה וְלֹא עָתִיד לִהְיוֹת, וְלָמָּה נִכְתַּב? דְּרוֹשׁ וְקַבֵּל שָׂכָר. כְּמַאן? כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: In accordance with whose is that which is taught There has never been a stubborn and rebellious son and there will never be in the future, And why, was written you may expound and receive reward In accordance with whose in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda,
llm_translation: As to where did he go? This is what is taught: A rebellious son and a stubborn teacher never were and never will be, so why was it written? Seek and receive reward. Whose opinion? Like Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן הִיא, דְּתַנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: וְכִי מִפְּנֵי שֶׁאָכַל זֶה תַּרְטֵימָר בָּשָׂר וְשָׁתָה חֲצִי לוֹג יַיִן הָאִיטַלְקִי, אָבִיו וְאִמּוֹ מוֹצִיאִין אוֹתוֹ לְסׇקְלוֹ? אֶלָּא לֹא הָיָה וְלֹא עָתִיד לִהְיוֹת, וְלָמָּה נִכְתַּב? דְּרוֹשׁ וְקַבֵּל שָׂכָר. אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן: אֲנִי רְאִיתִיו וְיָשַׁבְתִּי עַל קִבְרוֹ.
human_translation: If you wish, say is Rabbi Shimon. As it is taught Rabbi Shimon says: And is it due to that ate a tarteimar of meat and drank a half- log of Italian wine his father and his mother shall take him out to stone him? Rather, there has never been and there will never be in the future. And why, was written you may expound and receive reward Rabbi Yonatan says: I saw and I sat on his grave
llm_translation: If you wish, say: Rabbi Shimon is the one, as it was taught, Rabbi Shimon said: Just because this one ate a tarteimar of meat and drank half a log of Italian wine, should his father and mother take him out to be stoned? Rather, he did not exist and will not exist, so why was it written? Seek and you will find reward. Rabbi Yonatan said: I have seen him and sat on his grave.

hebrew_text: כְּמַאן אָזְלָא הָא דְּתַנְיָא: עִיר הַנִּדַּחַת לֹא הָיְתָה וְלֹא עֲתִידָה לִהְיוֹת, וְלָמָּה נִכְתְּבָה – דְּרוֹשׁ וְקַבֵּל שָׂכָר. כְּמַאן? כְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, דְּתַנְיָא: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר, כׇּל עִיר שֶׁיֵּשׁ בָּהּ אֲפִילּוּ מְזוּזָה אַחַת אֵינָהּ נַעֲשֵׂית עִיר הַנִּדַּחַת.
human_translation: In accordance with whose is that which is taught There has never been an idolatrous city and there will never be in the future, And why, was written you may expound and receive reward In accordance with whose in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer, as it is taught Rabbi Eliezer says: Any city that has even one mezuza cannot become an idolatrous city.
llm_translation: As to where did it go? This one that it teaches: A city of refuge was not, and will not be, and why was it written? - Seek and receive reward. As to where? Like Rabbi Eliezer, for it teaches: Rabbi Eliezer says, any city that has even one mezuzah in it does not become a city of refuge.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא? אָמַר קְרָא: ״וְאֶת כׇּל שְׁלָלָהּ תִּקְבֹּץ אֶל תּוֹךְ רְחֹבָהּ וְשָׂרַפְתָּ בָאֵשׁ״. וְכֵיוָן דְּאִי אִיכָּא מְזוּזָה, לָא אֶפְשָׁר, דִּכְתִיב: ״לֹא תַעֲשׂוּן כֵּן לַה׳ אֱלֹהֵיכֶם״. אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן: אֲנִי רְאִיתִיהָ וְיָשַׁבְתִּי עַל תִּילָּהּ.
human_translation: What is the reason The verse states: “And you shall gather all the spoil of it into the midst of the open space of the city, and shall burn with fire And since if there is a mezuza it is impossible as it is written: This you shall not do so to the Lord your God” Rabbi Yonatan says: I saw and I sat on its ruins.
llm_translation: What is the reason? The verse says: "And all its spoil you shall gather into the midst of its open square, and you shall burn the city with fire." And since if there is a mezuzah, it is not possible, as it is written: "You shall not do so to the Lord your God." Rabbi Yonatan said: I have seen it, and I sat on its threshold.

hebrew_text: כְּמַאן אָזְלָא הָא דְּתַנְיָא: בַּיִת הַמְנוּגָּע לֹא הָיָה וְלֹא עָתִיד לִהְיוֹת, וְלָמָּה נִכְתַּב – דְּרוֹשׁ וְקַבֵּל שָׂכָר. כְּמַאן? כְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, דִּתְנַן: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר, לְעוֹלָם אֵין הַבַּיִת טָמֵא עַד שֶׁיֵּרָאֶה כִּשְׁתֵּי גְרִיסִין עַל שְׁתֵּי אֲבָנִים בִּשְׁתֵּי כְתָלִים בְּקֶרֶן זָוִית, אׇרְכּוֹ כִּשְׁנֵי גְרִיסִין וְרׇחְבּוֹ כִּגְרִיס.
human_translation: In accordance with whose is that which is taught There has never been a house afflicted and there will never be in the future. And why, was written you may expound and receive reward In accordance with whose in accordance with Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, as we learned Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, says: A house never becomes impure until about the size of two split beans is seen on two stones in two walls a corner about two split beans in length and about one split bean in width.
llm_translation: As to where did it go? This one that was taught: A house afflicted with tzara'at was not and will not be, so why was it written - "Inquire and accept reward." As to where? Like Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Shimon, as we learned: Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Shimon says, "A house is never deemed impure until there appear two patches on two stones in two walls at a corner, its length like two patches and its width like a patch."

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן? כְּתִיב ״קִיר״ וּכְתִיב ״קִירֹת״. אֵיזֶהוּ קִיר שֶׁהוּא כְּקִירוֹת? הֱוֵי אוֹמֵר: זֶה קֶרֶן זָוִית.
human_translation: What is the reason of Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, it is written “wall,” and it is written “walls.” Which wall is like walls? You must say this is a corner.
llm_translation: What is the reason for Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon? It is written "wall" and it is written "walls." Which wall is like its walls? One would say: this is a corner wall.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא: אָמַר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בְּרַבִּי צָדוֹק, מָקוֹם הָיָה בִּתְחוּם עַזָּה, וְהָיוּ קוֹרִין אוֹתוֹ חוּרְבָּתָא סְגִירְתָּא. אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אִישׁ כְּפַר עַכּוֹ: פַּעַם אַחַת הָלַכְתִּי לְגָלִיל וְרָאִיתִי מָקוֹם שֶׁמְּצַיְּינִין אוֹתוֹ, וְאָמְרוּ: אֲבָנִים מְנוּגָּעוֹת פִּינוּ לְשָׁם.
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Eliezer, son of Rabbi Tzadok, says: There was a place in the area of Gaza, and it was called the leprous ruin; Rabbi Shimon of the village of Akko said: I once went to the Galilee and I saw a place that was being marked off and they said stones afflicted were cast there.
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Eliezer, son of Rabbi Tzadok, said, there was a place within the boundaries of Azah, and they would call it Churbata Segirta. Rabbi Shimon, man of Kfar Akko, said: Once I went to the Galilee and saw a place that they designate, and they said: "Stones that touch our mouths to that place."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הָיָה אֶחָד מֵהֶם גִּידֵּם, אוֹ חִיגֵּר, אוֹ אִלֵּם, אוֹ סוֹמֵא, אוֹ חֵרֵשׁ – אֵינוֹ נַעֲשֶׂה בֵּן סוֹרֵר וּמוֹרֶה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְתָפְשׂוּ בוֹ אָבִיו וְאִמּוֹ״ – וְלֹא גִּדְמִין, ״וְהוֹצִיאוּ אֹתוֹ״ – וְלֹא חִגְּרִין, ״וְאָמְרוּ״ – וְלֹא אִלְּמִין, ״בְּנֵנוּ זֶה״ – וְלֹא סוֹמִין, ״אֵינֶנּוּ שֹׁמֵעַ בְּקֹלֵנוּ״ – וְלֹא חֵרְשִׁין.
human_translation: If one of was without hands, or lame, or mute, or blind, or deaf, does not become a stubborn and rebellious son, as it is stated: “Then shall his father and his mother lay hold of him,” but not without hands, “And bring him out,” but not lame people, “And they shall say,” but not mutes. “This son of ours,” but not blind people, “He will not obey our voices,” but not deaf people,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If one of them had a twisted sinew, or a contracted nerve, or a mute, or a blind person, or a deaf person - he does not become a rebellious son and a stubborn one, as it is stated: "And they shall lay hold on him, his father and his mother" - not sinew-twisters, "and they shall bring him out" - not nerve-contractors, "and they shall say" - not muteness, "this our son" - not blindness, "who will not obey our voice" - not deafness.

hebrew_text: מַתְרִין בּוֹ בִּפְנֵי שְׁלֹשָׁה, וּמַלְקִין אוֹתוֹ. חָזַר וְקִלְקֵל – נִדּוֹן בְּעֶשְׂרִים וּשְׁלֹשָׁה, וְאֵינוֹ נִסְקָל עַד שֶׁיְּהוּ שָׁם שְׁלֹשָׁה הָרִאשׁוֹנִים, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״בְּנֵנוּ זֶה״ – זֶהוּ שֶׁלָּקָה בִּפְנֵיכֶם.
human_translation: he is admonished before three and they flog him he sins again, he is judged by twenty-three but he is not stoned unless the first three are there, as it is stated: “This son of ours,” this is who was flogged before you.
llm_translation: They permit it in the presence of three, and they flog him. If he repeated and made it worse - he is judged by twenty-three, and he is not stoned until the first three are there, as it is stated: "This son of ours" - this is the one who was flogged before you.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ שָׁמְעַתְּ מִינַּהּ: בָּעֵינַן קְרָא כְּדִכְתִיב? שָׁאנֵי הָכָא,
human_translation: You learn from we require a verse as it is written, Here it is different,
llm_translation: The text reads: "Did you hear heretical teaching from her? Do we need a verse as it is written? It is different here."

hebrew_text: דְּכוּלֵּיהּ קְרָא יַתִּירָא הוּא.
human_translation: since the entire verse is superfluous.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates to: "The entire verse is superfluous."

hebrew_text: וּמַתְרִין בִּפְנֵי שְׁלֹשָׁה? לְמָה לִי? בִּתְרֵי סַגְיָא! אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: הָכִי קָאָמַר – מַתְרִין בּוֹ בִּפְנֵי שְׁנַיִם, וּמַלְקִין אוֹתוֹ בִּפְנֵי שְׁלֹשָׁה.
human_translation: he is admonished before three Why do I Two suffice, Abaye says: This is saying: He is admonished before two and he is flogged before three
llm_translation: And permitted in the presence of three? Why do I need it? In two ways! Abaye said: This is what he is saying - permitted in it in the presence of two, and they flog him in the presence of three.

hebrew_text: מַלְקוּת בְּבֵן סוֹרֵר וּמוֹרֶה הֵיכָא כְּתִיבָא? כִּדְרַבִּי אֲבָהוּ, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: לָמַדְנוּ ״וְיִסְּרוּ״ מִ״וְּיִסְּרוּ״, ״וְיִסְּרוּ״ מִ״בֶּן״, וּ״בֶן״ מִ״בִּן״ – ״וְהָיָה אִם בִּן הַכּוֹת הָרָשָׁע״.
human_translation: Where is it written lashes to a stubborn and rebellious son? as Rabbi Abbahu as Rabbi Abbahu says: We learned “chastise” from “chastise” And “chastise” from “son” And “son [ ben ]” from “ bin ” “Then it shall be if the wicked man deserves [ bin ] to be flogged”
llm_translation: Punishment in the case of a wayward and rebellious son, where is it written? As Rabbi Avahu said, for Rabbi Avahu said: We learned "and they shall discipline" from "and they shall discipline," "and they shall discipline" from "son," and "son" from "son" - "If a man has a wayward and rebellious son."

hebrew_text: חָזַר וְקִלְקֵל, נִידּוֹן בְּעֶשְׂרִים וּשְׁלֹשָׁה [וְכוּ׳]. הַאי מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ: ״זֶה״ – וְלֹא סוֹמִין? אִם כֵּן, לִכְתּוֹב ״בְּנֵנוּ הוּא״. מַאי ״בְּנֵנוּ זֶה״? שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ תַּרְתֵּי.
human_translation: he sins again, he is judged by twenty-three that needed for “This but not blind people, If so, should have written: He is our son, What “This son of ours”? Conclude two from it:
llm_translation: He returned and made it worse, he is judged with twenty-three and so on. This one requires: "this" - and not we assume? If so, it should be written "he is his son." What is "he is his son"? Understand from it two.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ בָּרַח עַד שֶׁלֹּא נִגְמַר דִּינוֹ, וְאַחַר כָּךְ הִקִּיף זָקָן הַתַּחְתּוֹן – פָּטוּר. וְאִם מִשֶּׁנִּגְמַר דִּינוֹ בָּרַח, וְאַחַר כָּךְ הִקִּיף זָקָן הַתַּחְתּוֹן – חַיָּיב.
human_translation: ran away before he was sentenced, and afterward, his lower beard grew around, exempt But if he ran away after he was sentenced, and afterward, his lower beard had grown around, liable
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If he fled before his judgment was completed, and afterwards the elder of the lower court encircled him - he is exempt. But if his judgment was completed and then the elder of the lower court encircled him - he is liable.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: בֶּן נֹחַ שֶׁבֵּירַךְ אֶת הַשֵּׁם וְאַחַר כָּךְ נִתְגַּיֵּיר – פָּטוּר, הוֹאִיל וְנִשְׁתַּנָּה דִּינוֹ, נִשְׁתַּנֵּית מִיתָתוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina says: a descendant of Noah blessed, the name and afterward he converted exempt since his trial changed, and the death he changed.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara said Rabbi Chanina: Ben Noach she'birech et hashem ve'achar kach nitgayyer - patur, ho'il ve'nish'tanah dino, nishtanet mitato. English translation: Gemara said Rabbi Chanina: A Noachide who blesses the Name and then converts - is exempt, since his status has changed, his death has changed.

hebrew_text: נֵימָא מְסַיְּיעָא לֵיהּ: בָּרַח עַד שֶׁלֹּא נִגְמַר דִּינוֹ, וְאַחַר כָּךְ הִקִּיף זָקָן הַתַּחְתּוֹן – פָּטוּר. מַאי טַעְמָא? לָאו מִשּׁוּם דְּאָמְרִינַן: הוֹאִיל וְאִישְׁתַּנִּי – אִישְׁתַּנִּי?
human_translation: Shall we say supports him: ran away before he was sentenced, and afterward, his lower beard grew around, exempt What is the reason Isn’t it because we say: Since has changed, has changed?
llm_translation: The translation of the Talmudic text is as follows: It was stated as a support for him: One should run away until his judgment is not completed, and afterwards the elder of the lower court encircles him - he is exempt. What is the reason? Is it not because we say: Since he has changed - he has changed?

hebrew_text: לָא, שָׁאנֵי הָכָא, דְּאִי עֲבַד הַשְׁתָּא – לָאו בַּר קְטָלָא הוּא.
human_translation: No, it is different here, as were he now, to perform he would not be fit for execution,
llm_translation: Not, differs here, for if he did now - he is not a son of a murderer.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: אִם מִשֶּׁנִּגְמַר דִּינוֹ בָּרַח, וְאַחַר כָּךְ הִקִּיף זָקָן הַתַּחְתּוֹן – חַיָּיב. נִגְמַר דִּינוֹ קָאָמְרַתְּ? נִגְמַר דִּינוֹ גַּבְרָא קְטִילָא הוּא!
human_translation: Come hear if he ran away after he was sentenced, and afterward, his lower beard had grown around, liable you speak he was sentenced he was sentenced, he is a dead man
llm_translation: Come and hear: If his judgment was already completed and he fled, and afterwards the lower elder encircled him - he is liable. When you say his judgment was completed, what do you mean? His judgment is that of a man who is liable to be killed!

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: בֶּן נֹחַ שֶׁהִכָּה אֶת חֲבֵירוֹ, וּבָא עַל אֵשֶׁת חֲבֵירוֹ, וְנִתְגַּיֵּיר – פָּטוּר. עָשָׂה כֵּן בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל וְנִתְגַּיֵּיר – חַיָּיב. וְאַמַּאי? נֵימָא: הוֹאִיל וְאִישְׁתַּנִּי – אִישְׁתַּנִּי!
human_translation: Come hear a descendant of Noah struck another or engaged in intercourse with the wife of another and he converted exempt. he did this to an Israelite, and converted, liable. But why Let us say since changed, changed
llm_translation: Come and hear: A Ben Noach who struck his fellow, and came upon the wife of his fellow, and converted - he is exempt. If he did so in Israel and converted - he is liable. And why? Say: Since she is my wife - she is my wife!

hebrew_text: דִּינוֹ וּמִיתָתוֹ בָּעֵינַן, וְהַאי – דִּינוֹ אִישְׁתַּנִּי, מִיתָתוֹ לָא אִישְׁתַּנַּי.
human_translation: we require his trial and death But this his trial changed, death did not change.
llm_translation: His judgment and his death we require, and this - his judgment is changeable, his death is not changeable.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא רוֹצֵחַ, מֵעִיקָּרָא סַיִיף וְהַשְׁתָּא סַיִיף. אֶלָּא אֵשֶׁת אִישׁ, מֵעִיקָּרָא סַיִיף וְהַשְׁתָּא חֶנֶק?
human_translation: Granted, a murderer, initially, sword, and now sword. But a married woman, initially sword, but now strangulation.
llm_translation: In truth, regarding a murderer, from the outset it is a sword, and now it is a sword. But concerning a married woman, from the outset it is a sword, and now it is strangulation?

hebrew_text: בְּנַעֲרָה הַמְאוֹרָסָה, דְּאִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי בִּסְקִילָה.
human_translation: with a betrothed young woman, so that this and that by stoning.
llm_translation: In a betrothed maiden, both this one and that one are subject to stoning.

hebrew_text: וְהָא ״עָשָׂה כֵּן בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל״, דּוּמְיָא דְּאֵשֶׁת חֲבֵירוֹ קָתָנֵי.
human_translation: But teaches he did this to an Israelite, similar to the wife of another
llm_translation: And this, "He did so in Israel," is similar to the case of a man's wife.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, קַלָּה בַּחֲמוּרָה מֵישָׁךְ שָׁיְיכָא.
human_translation: Rather, the lenient is included in the severe
llm_translation: Rather, light in comparison to heavy, pulls its weight.

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לְרַבָּנַן דְּאָמְרִי: ״סַיִיף חָמוּר״, אֶלָּא לְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן דְּאָמַר: ״חֶנֶק חָמוּר״, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר?
human_translation: This works out well according to the Rabbis, who say sword is severe But according to Rabbi Shimon, who says strangulation is more severe what can be said?
llm_translation: The sages left it, as they say: "a severe sword," but for Rabbi Shimon who says: "a severe choking," what is there to say?

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן סָבַר לַהּ כְּתַנָּא דְבֵי מְנַשֶּׁה, דְּאָמַר: כׇּל מִיתָה הָאֲמוּרָה לִבְנֵי נֹחַ אֵינָהּ אֶלָּא חֶנֶק.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon holds in accordance with the tanna of the school of Menashe, who says: Any death mentioned in connection with the descendants of Noah is nothing other than strangulation,
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon holds according to the teaching of the House of Menashe, who said: "Every death mentioned for the descendants of Noah is nothing but strangulation."

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא אֵשֶׁת אִישׁ, מֵעִיקָּרָא חֶנֶק וְהַשְׁתָּא חֶנֶק. אֶלָּא רוֹצֵחַ, מֵעִיקָּרָא חֶנֶק וְהַשְׁתָּא סַיִיף? קַלָּה בַּחֲמוּרָה מֵישָׁךְ שָׁיְיכָא.
human_translation: Granted, a married woman, Initially, strangulation, and now, strangulation. But a murderer, initially, strangulation, but now, sword. The lenient is included in the severe
llm_translation: In truth, the wife of a man, initially death by strangulation and then death by strangulation. But a murderer, initially death by strangulation and then death by the sword? Lighter punishment drawn from a more severe one is appropriate.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא מְסַיְּיעָא לֵיהּ: סָרְחָה, וְאַחַר כָּךְ בָּגְרָה – תִּידּוֹן בְּחֶנֶק. בִּסְקִילָה מַאי טַעְמָא לָא? לָאו מִשּׁוּם דְּהוֹאִיל וְאִישְׁתַּנַּי אִישְׁתַּנִּי? וְכׇל שֶׁכֵּן הָכָא דְּאִישְׁתַּנִּי לִגְמָרֵי! הָאָמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן לְתַנָּא: תְּנִי ״תִּידּוֹן בִּסְקִילָה״.
human_translation: Shall we say supports sinned and afterward she reached her majority, she is sentenced by strangulation What is the reason not by stoning, Is it not since changed, changed And all the more so here, where he changed completely doesn’t Rabbi Yoḥanan say to the tanna teach: She is sentenced by stoning.
llm_translation: Let us say it assists him: she sinned, and afterwards she rebelled - they shall judge by strangulation. In stoning, what is the reason why not? Is it not because she changed her behavior? All the more so here, where she completely changed! Rabbi Yochanan said to the Tanna: Teach "they shall judge by stoning."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ בֵּן סוֹרֵר וּמוֹרֶה נִידּוֹן עַל שֵׁם סוֹפוֹ. יָמוּת זַכַּאי וְאַל יָמוּת חַיָּיב, שֶׁמִּיתָתָן שֶׁל רְשָׁעִים – הֲנָאָה לָהֶן וַהֲנָאָה לָעוֹלָם. לַצַּדִּיקִים – רַע לָהֶן וְרַע לָעוֹלָם.
human_translation: A stubborn and rebellious son is sentenced on account of his ultimate end, he should die innocent, and not die guilty. because the death of the wicked is beneficial to them, and beneficial to the world, of the righteous is detrimental to them, and detrimental to the world,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: A rebellious son and a rebellious elder are judged based on their end. If the elder dies righteous, he is considered innocent; if he dies guilty, it is beneficial for them and beneficial for the world. For the righteous, it is harmful for them and harmful for the world.

hebrew_text: יַיִן וְשֵׁינָה לָרְשָׁעִים – הֲנָאָה לָהֶן וַהֲנָאָה לָעוֹלָם, וְלַצַּדִּיקִים – רַע לָהֶן וְרַע לָעוֹלָם.
human_translation: wine and sleep of the wicked are beneficial to them and beneficial to the world, And, of the righteous are detrimental to them and detrimental to the world,
llm_translation: "Wine and sleep for the wicked - pleasure for them and pleasure for the world, and for the righteous - harm for them and harm for the world."

hebrew_text: פִּיזּוּר לָרְשָׁעִים – הֲנָאָה לָהֶן וַהֲנָאָה לָעוֹלָם. וְלַצַּדִּיקִים – רַע לָהֶן וְרַע לָעוֹלָם. כִּנּוּס לָרְשָׁעִים – רַע לָהֶן וְרַע לָעוֹלָם. וְלַצַּדִּיקִים – הֲנָאָה לָהֶן וַהֲנָאָה לָעוֹלָם. שֶׁקֶט לָרְשָׁעִים – רַע לָהֶן וְרַע לָעוֹלָם. לַצַּדִּיקִים – הֲנָאָה לָהֶן וַהֲנָאָה לָעוֹלָם.
human_translation: dispersal of the wicked, is beneficial to them, and beneficial to the world. of the righteous is detrimental to them and detrimental to the world. assembly of the wicked is detrimental to them and detrimental to the world, of the righteous is beneficial to them and beneficial to the world. tranquility of the wicked is detrimental to them and detrimental to the world, of the righteous is beneficial to them and beneficial to the world.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Pizur laresha'im - hanah lahen vahanah la'olam. Velatzaddikim - ra lahen vera la'olam. Kinus laresha'im - ra lahen vera la'olam. Velatzaddikim - hanah lahen vahanah la'olam. Sheket laresha'im - ra lahen vera la'olam. Latzaddikim - hanah lahen vahanah la'olam."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי אוֹמֵר: וְכִי מִפְּנֵי שֶׁאָכַל זֶה תַּרְטֵימָר בָּשָׂר וְשָׁתָה חֲצִי לוֹג יַיִן הָאִיטַלְקִי אָמְרָה תּוֹרָה יֵצֵא לְבֵית דִּין לִיסָּקֵל? אֶלָּא הִגִּיעָה תּוֹרָה לְסוֹף דַּעְתּוֹ שֶׁל בֵּן סוֹרֵר וּמוֹרֶה, שֶׁסּוֹף מְגַמֵּר נִכְסֵי אָבִיו וּמְבַקֵּשׁ לִמּוּדוֹ וְאֵינוֹ מוֹצֵא, וְיוֹצֵא לְפָרָשַׁת דְּרָכִים וּמְלַסְטֵם אֶת הַבְּרִיּוֹת.
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Yosei HaGelili says: due to that ate a tarteimar of meat and drank a half- log of Italian wine the Torah states he shall be taken out to court to be stoned? Rather, the Torah penetrated the ultimate mind-set of the stubborn and rebellious son that in the end he will squander his father’s property, and seeking to which he had become accustomed but not finding he will go out to the crossroads and rob people.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemara: Rabbi Yosei HaGalili says: Just because this one ate a half a loaf of meat and drank half a log of Italian wine, should the Torah have to come to the end of the judgment of a wayward and rebellious son, who ultimately consumes his father's property and seeks his own learning but does not find it, and goes out to highway robbery and preys upon people." English translation:

hebrew_text: אָמְרָה תּוֹרָה: יָמוּת זַכַּאי וְאַל יָמוּת חַיָּיב, שֶׁמִּיתָתָן שֶׁל רְשָׁעִים – הֲנָאָה לָהֶם וַהֲנָאָה לָעוֹלָם, וְלַצַּדִּיקִים – רַע לָהֶם וְרַע לָעוֹלָם. שֵׁינָה וְיַיִן לָרְשָׁעִים – הֲנָאָה לָהֶם וַהֲנָאָה לָעוֹלָם, לַצַּדִּיקִים – רַע לָהֶם וְרַע לָעוֹלָם. שֶׁקֶט לָרְשָׁעִים – רַע לָהֶם וְרַע לָעוֹלָם, וְלַצַּדִּיקִים – הֲנָאָה לָהֶם וַהֲנָאָה לָעוֹלָם. פִּיזּוּר לָרְשָׁעִים – הֲנָאָה לָהֶם וַהֲנָאָה לָעוֹלָם, וְלַצַּדִּיקִים – רַע לָהֶם וְרַע לָעוֹלָם.
human_translation: The Torah said he should die innocent, and not die guilty. because the death of the wicked is beneficial to them and beneficial to the world, of the righteous is detrimental to them and detrimental to the world. sleep and wine of the wicked is beneficial to them and beneficial to the world, of the righteous is detrimental to them and detrimental to the world. tranquility of the wicked is detrimental to them and detrimental to the world, of the righteous is beneficial to them and beneficial to the world. dispersal of the wicked is beneficial to them and beneficial to the world, of the righteous is detrimental to them and detrimental to the world.
llm_translation: The Torah said: Let the innocent die and not the guilty, for the death of the wicked is beneficial to them and beneficial to the world, while for the righteous it is harmful to them and harmful to the world. Sleep and wine for the wicked - beneficial to them and beneficial to the world, for the righteous - harmful to them and harmful to the world. Quiet for the wicked - harmful to them and harmful to the world, and for the righteous - beneficial to them and beneficial to the world. Dispersal for the wicked - beneficial to them and beneficial to the world, and for the righteous - harmful to them and harmful to the world.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַבָּא בַּמַּחְתֶּרֶת נִידּוֹן עַל שֵׁם סוֹפוֹ. הָיָה בָּא בַּמַּחְתֶּרֶת וְשָׁבַר אֶת הֶחָבִית, אִם יֵשׁ לוֹ דָּמִים – חַיָּיב, אִם אֵין לוֹ דָּמִים – פָּטוּר.
human_translation: A burglar sentenced on account of his ultimate end, was breaking into and he broke a barrel, if there is blood for him, liable If there is no blood for him, exempt
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who enters a cave is judged based on its end. If one entered a cave and broke a barrel, if there is blood - he is liable; if there is no blood - he is exempt.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רָבָא: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּמַחְתֶּרֶת? חֲזָקָה אֵין אָדָם מַעֲמִיד עַצְמוֹ עַל מָמוֹנוֹ, וְהַאי מֵימָר אָמַר: אִי אָזֵילְנָא, קָאֵי לְאַפַּאי וְלָא שָׁבֵיק לִי, וְאִי קָאֵי לְאַפַּאי – קָטֵילְנָא לֵיהּ. וְהַתּוֹרָה אָמְרָה: אִם בָּא לְהוֹרְגְּךָ – הַשְׁכֵּם לְהוֹרְגוֹ.
human_translation: Rava says: What is the reason for a burglar a presumption a person does not restrain himself with his money, and this must have said If I go rise against me and not allow me and if he rises against me, I will kill him. And the Torah stated If comes to kill you, rise and kill him
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara said Rava: What is the reason for the exemption of a pursuer? It is a presumption that a person does not place himself in danger for his money. And this statement said: If I go, he stands to kill me and does not leave me, and if he stands to kill me, I will kill him. And the Torah said: If someone comes to kill you, rise early to kill him.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב: הַבָּא בַּמַּחְתֶּרֶת וְנָטַל כֵּלִים וְיָצָא – פָּטוּר. מַאי טַעְמָא? בְּדָמִים קְנָנְהוּ. אָמַר רָבָא: מִסְתַּבְּרָא מִילְּתֵיהּ דְּרַב בְּשֶׁשִּׁיבֵּר, דְּלֵיתַנְהוּ, אֲבָל נָטַל – לָא.
human_translation: Rav says: broke into and took vessels, and left exempt What is the reason? He acquired with blood. Rava says: Rav’s statement is reasonable where he broke so that they no longer exist, But he took not
llm_translation: Rav said: One who enters the storehouse and takes utensils and leaves - is exempt. What is the reason? He acquired them with money. Rava said: The statement of Rav is logical in a case where there are no witnesses, but if he takes them - no.

hebrew_text: וְהָאֱלֹהִים! אָמַר רַב: אֲפִילּוּ נָטַל – דְּהָא יֵשׁ לוֹ דָּמִים וְנֶאֶנְסוּ, חַיָּיב. אַלְמָא בִּרְשׁוּתֵיהּ קָיְימִי. הָכָא נָמֵי, בִּרְשׁוּתֵיהּ קָיְימִי.
human_translation: But by God! Rav states even took as there is blood for him, an accident occurred to liable Apparently, are established in possession, Here also, are established in possession
llm_translation: "And God! Said Rav: Even if he took - for he has blood and they were forced, liable. Implied: with his consent he stands. Here too, with his consent he stands."

hebrew_text: וְלָא הִיא, כִּי אוֹקְמִינְהוּ רַחֲמָנָא בִּרְשׁוּתֵיהּ לְעִנְיַן אֳנָסִין, אֲבָל לְעִנְיַן מִקְנָא – בִּרְשׁוּתֵיהּ דְּמָרַיְיהוּ קָיְימִי, מִידֵּי דְּהָוֵה אַשּׁוֹאֵל.
human_translation: But is not when the Merciful One established in possession, concerning accidents, But as for ownership, they remain in the possession of their owner, just as it is in a borrower.
llm_translation: And not this, for if the Merciful One established them with His permission for matters of coercion, but for matters of zeal - with the permission of their masters they are established, as it would be a question.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: בָּא בַּמַּחְתֶּרֶת וְשִׁיבֵּר אֶת הֶחָבִית, יֵשׁ לוֹ דָּמִים – חַיָּיב, אֵין לוֹ דָּמִים – פָּטוּר. טַעְמָא דְּשִׁיבֵּר, דְּכִי אֵין לוֹ דָּמִים פָּטוּר. הָא נָטַל – לָא.
human_translation: We learned was breaking into and he broke a barrel, there is blood for him, liable there is no blood for him, exempt the reason is that he broke so where there is no blood for him, exempt But he took not
llm_translation: We learned in the Mishnah: If one entered a cave and broke a barrel, if there is blood - he is liable; if there is no blood - he is exempt. The reason for exemption when there is no blood is because he broke it. If he took it out - no.

hebrew_text: הוּא הַדִּין דַּאֲפִילּוּ נָטַל נָמֵי, וְהָא דְּקָא תָנֵי ״שָׁבַר אֶת הֶחָבִית״, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דְּכִי יֵשׁ לוֹ דָּמִים, אַף עַל גַּב דְּשִׁיבֵּר נָמֵי – חַיָּיב.
human_translation: The same is true, even he took And that which was taught He broke the barrel, teach us that when there is blood for him, even though he broke also liable
llm_translation: He similarly, that even took, and the one who is teaching "he broke the barrel," is heard to us that when there is blood, even though he spoke - liable.

hebrew_text: פְּשִׁיטָא, מַזִּיק הוּא! הָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דַּאֲפִילּוּ שֶׁלֹּא בְּכַוָּונָה. מַאי קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן? אָדָם מוּעָד לְעוֹלָם? תְּנֵינָא: אָדָם מוּעָד לְעוֹלָם, בֵּין בְּשׁוֹגֵג בֵּין בְּמֵזִיד, בֵּין בְּאוֹנֶס בֵּין בְּרָצוֹן! קַשְׁיָא.
human_translation: obvious is who causes damage This teaches us that even unintentionally. What teaching us a person always forewarned, we learn a person always forewarned, whether unintentionally or intentionally, whether by unavoidable accident or whether willingly. a difficulty
llm_translation: The text reads: "Peshita, mazik hu! Ha ka mashma lan daafilu shelo bekavvanah. Mai ka mashma lan? Adam mu'ad le'olam? Tenina: Adam mu'ad le'olam, bein beshogeg bein bemezid, bein be'ones bein beratzon! Kashya."

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַב בִּיבִי בַּר אַבָּיֵי: הַגּוֹנֵב כִּיס בְּשַׁבָּת – חַיָּיב, שֶׁהֲרֵי נִתְחַיֵּיב בִּגְנֵיבָה קוֹדֶם שֶׁיָּבֹא לִידֵי אִיסּוּר שַׁבָּת.
human_translation: Rav Beivai bar Abaye raises an objection One who steals a purse on Shabbat liable because he was liable for theft before he came to the prohibition of Shabbat
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: Rav Beivi bar Abbaye asks: One who steals a purse on Shabbat - is liable, for he is already liable for theft before he becomes liable for the prohibition of Shabbat.

hebrew_text: הָיָה מְגָרֵר וְיוֹצֵא – פָּטוּר, שֶׁהֲרֵי אִיסּוּר גְּנֵבָה וְאִיסּוּר סְקִילָה בָּאִין כְּאֶחָד.
human_translation: he was dragging and exiting exempt as the prohibition of theft and the prohibition of stoning, simultaneously,
llm_translation: He was dragging and leaving - exempt, for the prohibition of theft and the prohibition of stoning come together as one.

hebrew_text: וְהִלְכְתָא: דִּשְׁדָנְהוּ בְּנַהֲרָא.
human_translation: And the halakha where threw into a river.
llm_translation: And the halakha: they judged him by the river.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אִיגְּנַבוּ לֵיהּ דִּיכְרֵי בְּמַחְתַּרְתָּא. אַהְדְּרִינְהוּ נִיהֲלֵיהּ, וְלָא קַבְּלִינְהוּ. אָמַר: הוֹאִיל וּנְפַק מִפּוּמֵּיהּ דְּרַב.
human_translation: rams were stolen from Rava by burglars who broke return to him, but did not accept them. said: Since issued from Rav’s mouth
llm_translation: Rava Ignavu leih dikhrei b'machtarta. Ahdreinhu niha'leih, v'lo kabb'leihu. Amar: Ho'il u'nefak mipumeih d'Rav.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״אֵין לוֹ דָּמִים. אִם זָרְחָה הַשֶּׁמֶשׁ עָלָיו״. וְכִי הַשֶּׁמֶשׁ עָלָיו בִּלְבַד זָרְחָה? אֶלָּא, אִם בָּרוּר לְךָ הַדָּבָר כַּשֶּׁמֶשׁ שֶׁאֵין לוֹ שָׁלוֹם עִמְּךָ – הׇרְגֵהוּ, וְאִם לָאו – אַל תַּהְרְגֵהוּ.
human_translation: the Sages taught there shall not be blood shed on his account. If the sun is risen upon him, But did the sun rise only upon him? Rather, If the matter is as clear to you as the sun that is not to you in peace, kill him But if not do not kill him.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: "He has no blood. If the sun has risen upon him." And is it only if the sun has risen upon him? Rather, if the matter is clear to you like the sun that has no peace with you - kill him, and if not - do not kill him.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא אִידַּךְ: ״אִם זָרְחָה הַשֶּׁמֶשׁ עָלָיו דָּמִים לוֹ״. וְכִי הַשֶּׁמֶשׁ עָלָיו בִּלְבַד זָרְחָה? אֶלָּא, אִם בָּרוּר לְךָ כַּשֶּׁמֶשׁ שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ שָׁלוֹם עִמְּךָ – אַל תַּהַרְגֵהוּ, וְאִם לָאו – הׇרְגֵהוּ. קַשְׁיָא סְתָמָא אַסְּתָמָא!
human_translation: It is taught another “If the sun is risen upon him, there shall be blood shed on his account.” But did the sun rise only upon him? Rather, If the matter is as clear to you as the sun that is to you in peace, do not kill him. But if not kill him. undetermined contradicts undetermined
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: "If the sun shone upon him, blood is his." Is it only if the sun shone upon him? Rather, if it is clear to you like the sun that he is at peace with you - do not kill him. But if not - kill him. A difficult question, an unresolved question!

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא,
human_translation: not difficult.
llm_translation: Not difficult.

hebrew_text: כָּאן – בְּאָב עַל הַבֵּן, כָּאן – בְּבֵן עַל הָאָב.
human_translation: Here, a father to son. There, a son to father.
llm_translation: Here is the English translation: Here - with the father upon the son, here - with the son upon the father.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב: כֹּל דְּאָתֵי עֲלַאי בְּמַחְתַּרְתָּא – קָטֵילְנָא לֵיהּ, לְבַר מֵרַב חֲנִינָא בַּר שֵׁילָא. מַאי טַעְמָא? אִילֵּימָא מִשּׁוּם דְּצַדִּיק הוּא – הָא קָאָתֵי בְּמַחְתַּרְתָּא! אֶלָּא מִשּׁוּם דְּקִים לִי בְּגַוֵּויהּ דִּמְרַחֵם עָלַי כְּרַחֵם אָב עַל הַבֵּן.
human_translation: Rav says: anyone who breaks into my I would kill except for Rav Ḥanina bar Sheila, What is the reason If we say because he is a righteous person, as he broke into house, Rather, because I am certain that he would have mercy upon me like a father on a son.
llm_translation: Rav said: Anyone who comes to me with a claim in the courtyard - I will kill him, except for Bar Merav Chanina Bar Sheilah. What is the reason? If you say because he is righteous - he also comes with a claim in the courtyard! Rather, because he stands by me like one who has mercy on me, like a father has mercy on his son.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״דָּמִים לוֹ״ – בֵּין בַּחוֹל בֵּין בַּשַּׁבָּת, ״אֵין לוֹ דָּמִים״ – בֵּין בַּחוֹל בֵּין בַּשַּׁבָּת.
human_translation: The Sages taught there shall be blood shed on his account” both during the week and on Shabbat. in…there shall not be blood shed on his account” both during the week and on Shabbat.
llm_translation: The sages taught: "He has blood" - whether on a weekday or on Shabbat, "he has no blood" - whether on a weekday or on Shabbat.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא ״אֵין לוֹ דָּמִים״ בֵּין בַּחוֹל בֵּין בַּשַּׁבָּת אִיצְטְרִיךְ, סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: מִידֵּי דְּהָוֵה אַהֲרוּגֵי בֵּית דִּין, דִּבְשַׁבָּת לָא קָטְלִינַן. קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דְּקָטְלִינַן. אֶלָּא ״דָּמִים לוֹ״ בֵּין בַּחוֹל בֵּין בַּשַּׁבָּת? הַשְׁתָּא בַּחוֹל לָא קָטְלִינַן לֵיהּ, בַּשַּׁבָּת מִבַּעְיָא?
human_translation: Granted “there shall not be blood shed on his account,” was necessary both during the week and on Shabbat, enter your mind to say just as it is those who are executed by the court, who are not executed on Shabbat. teaches us that may be slain But “there shall be blood shed on his account,” both during the week and on Shabbat Now, on a weekday he may not be slain, is it necessary on Shabbat?
llm_translation: In truth, "he has no blood" whether on a weekday or on Shabbat is necessary. It is logical to say: since they are liable to be executed by the court, we do not kill on Shabbat. It implies to us that we do kill. Rather, "he has blood" whether on a weekday or on Shabbat? Now, on a weekday we do not kill him, but on Shabbat we require it?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: לָא נִצְרְכָא אֶלָּא לְפַקֵּחַ עָלָיו אֶת הַגַּל.
human_translation: Rav Sheshet says: is necessary only to clear the pile on top of him
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet said: It was only necessary to open the barrel upon it.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״וְהֻכָּה״ – בְּכׇל אָדָם, ״וָמֵת״ – בְּכׇל מִיתָה שֶׁאַתָּה יָכוֹל לַהֲמִיתוֹ. בִּשְׁלָמָא ״וְהֻכָּה״ בְּכׇל אָדָם אִיצְטְרִיךְ, סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: בַּעַל הַבַּיִת הוּא דְּקִים לֵהּוֹ, דְּאֵין אָדָם מַעֲמִיד עַצְמוֹ עַל מָמוֹנוֹ, אֲבָל אַחֵר – לָא.
human_translation: the Sages taught “And is smitten,” by any person “and dies,” by any death by which you can put him to death. Granted, “and is smitten,” was necessary by any person, enter your mind to say the owner of the house whom is certain that a person does not restrain himself with his money, But another person, not
llm_translation: The sages taught: "And he shall be beaten" - with regard to every person, "and die" - in every death that you are able to cause him. Now, "And he shall be beaten" with regard to every person, is necessary. Would you say: It is the homeowner who establishes it, for a person does not put himself at risk for his money, but another person - no.

hebrew_text: קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן, דְּרוֹדֵף הוּא, וַאֲפִילּוּ אַחֵר נָמֵי. אֶלָּא ״וָמֵת״ בְּכׇל מִיתָה שֶׁאַתָּה יָכוֹל לַהֲמִיתוֹ, לְמָה לִי?
human_translation: teaches us that is a pursuer, and even another person But “and dies” by any death by which you can put him to death, why do I
llm_translation: We hear, that he is a pursuer, even after others. Rather, "and he shall die" in any death that you are able to kill him, why do I need it?

hebrew_text: מֵרוֹצֵחַ נָפְקָא, דְּתַנְיָא: ״מוֹת יוּמַת הַמַּכֶּה רֹצֵחַ הוּא״ – אֵין לִי אֶלָּא בְּמִיתָה הָאֲמוּרָה בּוֹ. וּמִנַּיִן שֶׁאִם אִי אַתָּה יָכוֹל לַהֲמִיתוֹ בְּמִיתָה הַכְּתוּבָה בּוֹ, שֶׁאַתָּה רַשַּׁאי לַהֲמִיתוֹ בְּכׇל מִיתָה שֶׁאַתָּה יָכוֹל לַהֲמִיתוֹ? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״מוֹת יוּמַת״ – מִכׇּל מָקוֹם.
human_translation: derived from a murderer, as it is taught “He that smote him shall be put to death, for he is a murderer” I have only with the execution stated concerning him, From where that if you cannot put him to death with the execution written concerning him, that you can put him to death with any execution with which you can put him to death? The verse states: shall be put to death [ mot yumat ],” in any case,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Me'rotze'ach nafka, d'tan'ya: 'Mot yumat hamakeh rotze'ach hu' - ein li ela bemitah ha'amurah bo. Uminayin she'im atah yakhol lahamito bemitah haketuvah bo, she'ata rashai lahamito bechol mitah she'ata yakhol lahamito? Talmud lomar: 'Mot yumat' - mikol makom." English translation: "From the murderer it is derived, as it was taught: 'He shall surely be put to death, the one who strikes a murderer' - I have only with the death mentioned in him. And from where do we know that if you are able to kill him with the death prescribed for him, that you are permitted to kill him with any death that you are able to kill him? The Talmud teaches: 'He shall surely be put to death' - from any place."

hebrew_text: שָׁאנֵי הָתָם, דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״מוֹת יוּמַת״.
human_translation: There it is different, as the verse states: “ Mot yumat ,”
llm_translation: The matter there is different, as the verse states: "He shall surely be put to death."

hebrew_text: וְנִיגְמַר מִינֵּיהּ? מִשּׁוּם דְּהָוֵה רוֹצֵחַ וְגוֹאֵל הַדָּם שְׁנֵי כְתוּבִין הַבָּאִין כְּאֶחָד, וְכׇל שְׁנֵי כְתוּבִין הַבָּאִין כְּאֶחָד אֵין מְלַמְּדִין.
human_translation: But learn from it because a murderer and a blood redeemer, are two verses that come as one, and two verses that come as one do not teach
llm_translation: And is it concluded from this? Because he becomes a murderer and the blood redeemer, two Scriptures that come as one, and any two Scriptures that come as one do not teach.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״מַחְתֶּרֶת״ – אֵין לִי אֶלָּא מַחְתֶּרֶת. גַּגּוֹ, חֲצֵירוֹ וְקַרְפֵּיפוֹ מִנַּיִן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״יִמָּצֵא הַגַּנָּב״ – מִכׇּל מָקוֹם. אִם כֵּן, מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״מַחְתֶּרֶת״? מִפְּנֵי שֶׁרוֹב גַּנָּבִים מְצוּיִין בַּמַּחְתֶּרֶת.
human_translation: The Sages taught breaking in” I have only breaking in from where his roof, his yard, or the enclosed area his the verse states: a burglar is found,” in any case. If so, what the verse states: “Breaking in”? Because most thieves are found breaking in.
llm_translation: The sages taught: "Machteret" - I have only "machteret." His roof, his courtyard, and his threshing floor - from where? The Talmud teaches: "The thief shall be found" - from any place. If so, why does the Talmud say "machteret"? Because most thieves are found in the "machteret."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא אִידַּךְ: ״מַחְתֶּרֶת״ – אֵין לִי אֶלָּא מַחְתֶּרֶת. גַּגּוֹ, חֲצֵירוֹ וְקַרְפֵּיפוֹ מִנַּיִן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״יִמָּצֵא הַגַּנָּב״ – מִכׇּל מָקוֹם. אִם כֵּן, מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״מַחְתֶּרֶת״? מַחְתַּרְתּוֹ זוֹ הִיא הַתְרָאָתוֹ.
human_translation: It is taught another breaking in,” I have only breaking in from where his roof, his yard, or the enclosed area his the verse states: a burglar is found,” in any case. If so, what the verse states: “Breaking in”? his breaking in is his forewarning.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: "Machteret" - I have only "Machteret." His roof, his courtyard, and his cave, from where? The Talmud teaches: "If the thief is found" - from any place. If so, why does the Talmud say "Machteret"? His "Machteret" is his identification.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: קָטָן הָרוֹדֵף, נִיתָּן לְהַצִּילוֹ בְּנַפְשׁוֹ. קָסָבַר, רוֹדֵף אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ הַתְרָאָה, לָא שְׁנָא גָּדוֹל וְלָא שְׁנָא קָטָן.
human_translation: Rav Huna says: a minor was pursuing may be saved with life. maintains a pursuer, does not require forewarning, there is no difference between an adult and a minor.
llm_translation: Rav Huna said: A minor who is pursued, one may save him with his life. He holds that a pursuer does not require warning, whether he is an adult or a minor.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רַב חִסְדָּא לְרַב הוּנָא: יָצָא רֹאשׁוֹ – אֵין נוֹגְעִין בּוֹ, לְפִי שֶׁאֵין דּוֹחִין נֶפֶשׁ מִפְּנֵי נֶפֶשׁ. וְאַמַּאי? רוֹדֵף הוּא! שָׁאנֵי הָתָם, דְּמִשְּׁמַיָּא קָא רָדְפִי לַהּ.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda raised an objection to Rav Huna his head has emerged he may not be harmed because life may not be pushed aside to life. why is a pursuer it is different there, since she is being pursued by Heaven.
llm_translation: He raised an objection to Rav Hizda against Rav Huna: If his head emerged - one does not touch it, because one does not push away one life because of another life. And why? He is a pursuer! It is different there, for he is pursuing from heaven.

hebrew_text: נֵימָא מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ: רוֹדֵף שֶׁהָיָה רוֹדֵף אַחַר חֲבֵירוֹ לְהוֹרְגוֹ, אוֹמְרִין לוֹ: רְאֵה שֶׁיִּשְׂרָאֵל הוּא וּבֶן בְּרִית הוּא, וְהַתּוֹרָה אָמְרָה ״שֹׁפֵךְ דַּם הָאָדָם בָּאָדָם דָּמוֹ יִשָּׁפֵךְ״. אָמְרָה תּוֹרָה: הַצֵּל דָּמוֹ שֶׁל זֶה בְּדָמוֹ שֶׁל זֶה.
human_translation: Let us say supports a pursuer was pursuing another in order to kill him, says to See that he is a Jew, and member of the covenant, and the Torah stated: “Whoever sheds the blood of man, by man shall his blood be shed” The Torah stated: Save the blood of this with the blood of that
llm_translation: The Gemara supports him: If one was pursuing his fellow to kill him, they say to him: See that this is an Israelite and a descendant of a covenant, and the Torah said, "Whoever sheds the blood of man, by man shall his blood be shed." The Torah said: Save the life of this one with the life of this one.

hebrew_text: הָהִיא רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה הִיא, דְּתַנְיָא: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר, חָבֵר אֵין צָרִיךְ הַתְרָאָה, לְפִי שֶׁלֹּא נִיתְּנָה הַתְרָאָה אֶלָּא לְהַבְחִין בֵּין שׁוֹגֵג לְמֵזִיד.
human_translation: this Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda. As it is taught Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: A ḥaver , does not need a forewarning because forewarning is given only to distinguish between unintentional and intentional
llm_translation: That one, Rabbi Yosei son of Rabbi Yehuda, that is, as it was taught: Rabbi Yosei son of Rabbi Yehuda says, "A colleague does not require warning, because warning was only given to distinguish between unintentional and intentional sin."

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: רוֹדֵף שֶׁהָיָה רוֹדֵף אַחַר חֲבֵירוֹ לְהוֹרְגוֹ, אֹמְרִין לוֹ: רְאֵה שֶׁיִּשְׂרָאֵל הוּא וּבֶן בְּרִית הוּא, וְהַתּוֹרָה אָמְרָה ״שֹׁפֵךְ דַּם הָאָדָם בָּאָדָם דָּמוֹ יִשָּׁפֵךְ״. אִם אָמַר: יוֹדֵעַ אֲנִי שֶׁהוּא כֵּן – פָּטוּר. עַל מְנָת כֵּן אֲנִי עוֹשֶׂה – חַיָּיב.
human_translation: Come hear a pursuer was pursuing another in order to kill him, said to him: See that he is a Jew, and member of the covenant, and the Torah stated: “Whoever sheds the blood of man, by man shall his blood be shed” if said: I know this to be so, exempt I am doing it on this condition, liable
llm_translation: Come and hear: A pursuer who was pursuing his fellow to kill him, they say to him: See that he is an Israelite and a descendant of the covenant, and the Torah said, "Whoever sheds the blood of man, by man shall his blood be shed." If he says: I know that this is so - he is exempt. But if he says: I will do it anyway - he is liable.

hebrew_text: לָא צְרִיכָא, דְּקָאֵי בִּתְרֵי עִיבְרֵי דְנַהְרָא, דְּלָא מָצֵי אַצּוֹלֵיה. מַאי אִיכָּא? דְּבָעֵי אֵיתוֹיֵי לְבֵי דִינָא. בֵּי דִינָא בָּעֵי הַתְרָאָה.
human_translation: not necessary where are standing on two sides of a river, that cannot save What is there he wants to bring to court, the court requires forewarning.
llm_translation: Not necessary, for it stands between two banks of the river, where it cannot be cut off. What is the reason? Because it requires supervision by the court. The court requires supervision.

hebrew_text: אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: אָמַר לְךָ רַב הוּנָא, אֲנָא דַּאֲמַרִי כְּתַנָּא דְּמַחְתֶּרֶת, דְּאָמַר: מַחְתַּרְתּוֹ זוֹ הִיא הַתְרָאָתוֹ.
human_translation: If you wish, say Rav Huna said to you: I stated in accordance with the tanna of breaks into As says his breaking in is his forewarning,
llm_translation: If you wish, I will say: Rav Huna said to you, "I am the one who said like the Tanna of Machteret, who said: 'His Machteret is his identification.'"

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ וְאֵלּוּ הֵן שֶׁמַּצִּילִין אוֹתָן בְּנַפְשָׁן: הָרוֹדֵף אַחַר חֲבֵירוֹ לְהׇרְגוֹ, וְאַחַר הַזָּכָר, וְאַחַר הַנַּעֲרָה הַמְאוֹרָסָה. אֲבָל הָרוֹדֵף אַחַר בְּהֵמָה, וְהַמְחַלֵּל אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת, וְעוֹבֵד עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה – אֵין מַצִּילִין אוֹתָן בְּנַפְשָׁן.
human_translation: And these are the ones who are saved at their lives; One who pursues another to kill him, or a male or a betrothed young woman But one who pursues an animal or one who desecrate Shabbat, or engage in idol worship, are not saved at their lives.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: And these are the ones who may be saved at the cost of their own lives: one who pursues after his fellow to kill him, and one who pursues after a male, and one who pursues after a betrothed maiden. But one who pursues after an animal, and one who desecrates the Sabbath, and one who worships idols - they are not saved at the cost of their own lives.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מִנַּיִין לְרוֹדֵף אַחַר חֲבֵירוֹ לְהׇרְגוֹ שֶׁנִּיתָּן לְהַצִּילוֹ בְּנַפְשׁוֹ? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״לֹא תַעֲמֹד עַל דַּם רֵעֶךָ״. וְהָא לְהָכִי הוּא דַּאֲתָא? הַאי מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְכִדְתַנְיָא: מִנַּיִין לָרוֹאֶה אֶת חֲבֵירוֹ שֶׁהוּא טוֹבֵעַ בַּנָּהָר, אוֹ חַיָּה גּוֹרַרְתּוֹ, אוֹ לִסְטִין בָּאִין עָלָיו, שֶׁהוּא חַיָּיב לְהַצִּילוֹ? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״לֹא תַעֲמֹד עַל דַּם רֵעֶךָ״. אִין, הָכִי נָמֵי.
human_translation: The Sages taught From where that with regard to one who pursues another to kill him, may be saved at life?
