The verse states: “You shall not stand idly by the blood of another” But does this come to this? This is required for that which is taught From where that one who sees another drowning in a river, or being dragged away by animal, or being attacked by bandits [ listin ], is obligated to save him? The Torah states: “You shall not stand idly by the blood of another.” Yes, is indeed so
llm_translation: The Sages taught: From where do we derive that one who pursues after his fellow to kill him may be saved by killing the pursuer in self-defense? The Torah teaches: "Do not stand idly by the blood of your neighbor." And is this the reason it came? This one wanted to teach according to what was taught: From where do we derive that one who sees his fellow drowning in the river, or a wild animal dragging him, or robbers coming upon him, that he is obligated to save him? The Torah teaches: "Do not stand idly by the blood of your neighbor." Yes, so it is said.

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא, נִיתָּן לְהַצִּילוֹ בְּנַפְשׁוֹ מְנָלַן? אָתְיָא בְּקַל וָחוֹמֶר מִנַּעֲרָה הַמְאוֹרָסָה: מָה נַעֲרָה הַמְאוֹרָסָה שֶׁלֹּא בָּא אֶלָּא לְפוֹגְמָהּ, אָמְרָה תּוֹרָה נִיתָּן לְהַצִּילָהּ בְּנַפְשׁוֹ, רוֹדֵף אַחַר חֲבֵירוֹ לְהׇרְגוֹ – עַל אַחַת כַּמָּה וְכַמָּה.
human_translation: But from where do we may be saved at life? derived by means of an a fortiori from a betrothed young woman If a betrothed young woman, whom comes only to degrade, the Torah said she may be saved at life, one who pursues another to kill him, all the more so
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And rather, is it possible to save him at the cost of his own life? It was derived by an inference from minor to major from the case of a betrothed maiden: Just as a betrothed maiden who came only to defile her, the Torah said it is permitted to save her at the cost of his own life, pursuing after his fellow to kill him - how much more so. English translation:

hebrew_text: וְכִי עוֹנְשִׁין מִן הַדִּין? דְּבֵי רַבִּי תָּנָא, הֶקֵּישָׁא הוּא: ״כִּי כַּאֲשֶׁר יָקוּם אִישׁ עַל רֵעֵהוּ וּרְצָחוֹ נֶפֶשׁ״. וְכִי מָה לָמַדְנוּ מֵרוֹצֵחַ?
human_translation: But does administer punishment on inference? of the school of Rabbi taught: is a juxtaposition. for as when a man rises against his neighbor, and slays him, But what do we learn from a murderer?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And are punishments from the court? The school of Rabbi taught, it is a comparison: 'As when a man rises against his neighbor and murders him.' And what have we learned from the murderer?"

hebrew_text: מֵעַתָּה הֲרֵי זֶה בָּא לְלַמֵּד וְנִמְצָא לָמֵד. מַקִּישׁ רוֹצֵחַ לְנַעֲרָה הַמְאוֹרָסָה: מָה נַעֲרָה הַמְאוֹרָסָה נִיתָּן לְהַצִּילָהּ בְּנַפְשׁוֹ, אַף רוֹצֵחַ נִיתָּן לְהַצִּילוֹ בְּנַפְשׁוֹ.
human_translation: Now, came to teach and it turns out it derives juxtaposes a murderer to a betrothed young woman just as one may save her at life, so too, a murderer, one may save at life.
llm_translation: From now on, behold, this one comes to teach and is found to have learned. He juxtaposes a murderer to a betrothed maiden: Just as for a betrothed maiden, it is possible to save her with his own life, so too for a murderer, it is possible to save him with his own life.

hebrew_text: וְנַעֲרָה מְאוֹרָסָה גּוּפַהּ מְנָלַן? כִּדְתָנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל, דְּתָנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: ״וְאֵין מוֹשִׁיעַ לָהּ״ – הָא יֵשׁ מוֹשִׁיעַ לָהּ, בְּכׇל דָּבָר שֶׁיָּכוֹל לְהוֹשִׁיעַ.
human_translation: And betrothed young woman herself, from where do we As it was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael: and there was none to save her” But if there was someone to save her, by any means that can save
llm_translation: "And a betrothed maiden, where is her body from? As it was taught in the school of Rabbi Ishmael, as it was taught in the school of Rabbi Ishmael: 'And there is no savior for her' - this means there is a savior for her, in any matter in which he can save her."

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא: מִנַּיִן לָרוֹאֶה אֶת חֲבֵרוֹ שֶׁהוּא טוֹבֵעַ בַּנָּהָר, אוֹ חַיָּה גּוֹרַרְתּוֹ, אוֹ לִסְטִין בָּאִין עָלָיו, שֶׁהוּא חַיָּיב לְהַצִּילוֹ? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״לֹא תַעֲמֹד עַל דַּם רֵעֶךָ״. וְהָא מֵהָכָא נָפְקָא? מֵהָתָם נָפְקָא! אֲבֵדַת גּוּפוֹ מִנַּיִין? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וַהֲשֵׁבֹתוֹ לוֹ״.
human_translation: the itself, From where that one who sees another drowning in a river, or being dragged away by animal, or being attacked by bandits, is obligated to save him? The verse states: “You shall not stand idly by the blood of another” But is this derived from here? derived from there, from where the loss of his body The verse states: “And you shall restore it [ vahashevato ] to him [ lo ]”
llm_translation: Body: From where do we know for one who sees his friend drowning in the river, or a wild animal dragging him, or robbers coming upon him, that he is obligated to save him? The Talmud teaches: "Do not stand idly by the blood of your neighbor." And from where is this derived? It is derived from there! How do we know for one who has lost his body? The Talmud teaches: "And you shall restore it to him."

hebrew_text: אִי מֵהָתָם, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: הָנֵי מִילֵּי בְּנַפְשֵׁיהּ, אֲבָל מִיטְרַח וּמֵיגַר אָגוֹרֵי – אֵימָא לָא. קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: If from there, I would say this matter to by himself, But to trouble himself and hire workers say not teaches us
llm_translation: From there, I would say: those words by themselves, but from trouble and from the merchants - I would say no. It is evident to us.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אֶחָד הָרוֹדֵף אַחַר חֲבֵירוֹ לְהׇרְגוֹ, וְאַחַר הַזָּכָר, וְאַחַר נַעֲרָה הַמְאוֹרָסָה, וְאַחַר חַיָּיבֵי מִיתוֹת בֵּית דִּין, וְאַחַר חַיָּיבֵי כָרֵיתוֹת – מַצִּילִין אוֹתָן בְּנַפְשׁוֹ. אַלְמָנָה לְכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל, גְּרוּשָׁה וַחֲלוּצָה לְכֹהֵן הֶדְיוֹט – אֵין מַצִּילִין אוֹתָן בְּנַפְשׁוֹ.
human_translation: The Sages taught One who pursues another to kill him; or a male or a betrothed young woman or liable to a court death or liable to karet , are to be saved at the life of a widow by a High Priest, a divorcée, or a woman who has performed ḥalitza [ ḥalutza ] by an ordinary priest, are not saved at life,
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: One who is pursuing his fellow to kill him, whether the pursued is a male, or a betrothed maiden, or one liable to receive capital punishment from the court, or one liable to receive karet - one may save them with his life. But a widow of a High Priest, a divorced woman, or a woman who has performed halitzah for a common priest - one may not save them with his life.

hebrew_text: נֶעֶבְדָה בָּהּ עֲבֵירָה – אֵין מַצִּילִין אוֹתָהּ בְּנַפְשׁוֹ. יֵשׁ לָהּ מוֹשִׁיעַ – אֵין מַצִּילִין אוֹתָהּ בְּנַפְשׁוֹ. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אַף הָאוֹמֶרֶת ״הַנִּיחוּ לוֹ״ שֶׁלֹּא יַהַרְגֶנָּה.
human_translation: a sin had already been committed she is not saved at life. there is one to save her, she is not saved at his life. Rabbi Yehuda says: Also, says Let be, so that he should not kill her,
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates as follows: "If she is being forced to commit a sin - one does not save her at the cost of his own life. If she has a way to save herself - one does not save her at the cost of his own life. Rabbi Yehuda says: Even if she says, 'Let him be,' do not kill her."

hebrew_text: מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? אָמַר קְרָא: ״וְלַנַּעֲרָה לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה דָבָר אֵין לַנַּעֲרָה חֵטְא מָוֶת״. ״נַעַר״ – זֶה זְכוּר, ״נַעֲרָה״ – זוֹ נַעֲרָה הַמְאוֹרָסָה, ״חֵטְא״ – אֵלּוּ חַיָּיבֵי כָרֵיתוֹת, ״מָוֶת״ – אֵלּוּ חַיָּיבֵי מִיתוֹת בֵּית דִּין.
human_translation: From where are these matters The verse states: “But you shall do nothing to the young woman [ na’ara ]; the young woman has committed no sin worthy of death” Na’ar , this is sodomy. “ Na’ara ,” this is a betrothed young woman. “Sin”; these are liable to karet . “Death”; these are liable to a court death
llm_translation: Talmudic text: What are these words? The verse says: "And to the young woman you shall do nothing; there is in the young woman no sin deserving death." "Young man" - this refers to a male; "young woman" - this refers to a betrothed young woman; "sin" - these are sins punishable by excision; "death" - these are sins punishable by death penalty by the court.

hebrew_text: כֹּל הָנֵי לְמָה לִי? צְרִיכִי, דְּאִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״נַעַר״ – מִשּׁוּם דְּלָאו אוֹרְחֵיהּ, אֲבָל נַעֲרָה דְּאוֹרְחַהּ – אֵימָא לָא.
human_translation: Why do I all these are necessary, as had the Merciful One written na’ar because it is not his way But a young woman, whose way say not
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates as follows: "Why do I need all these? I need it, for if the Merciful One wrote 'na'ar' - because he is not her regular way, but a na'arah who is her regular way - I would say no."

hebrew_text: וְאִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״נַעֲרָה״, מִשּׁוּם דְּקָא פָגֵים לַהּ, אֲבָל נַעַר דְּלָא קָא פָגֵים לֵיהּ – אֵימָא לָא.
human_translation: And had the Merciful One wrote “ na’ara ” because he degrades her But a young man, who is not degraded, say not
llm_translation: If the Merciful One wrote "na'arah," it is because he is harming her, but if he did not harm her, say no.

hebrew_text: וְאִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא הָנֵי,
human_translation: And had the Merciful One wrote these,
llm_translation: And if the Merciful One wrote these,

hebrew_text: מִשּׁוּם דְּהַאי לָאו אוֹרְחֵיהּ הוּא, וְהָא קָא פָגֵים לַהּ. אֲבָל שְׁאָר עֲרָיוֹת דְּאוֹרְחַיְיהוּ, וְלָא נְפִישׁ פִּיגְמַיְיהוּ, אֵימָא לָא. כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״חֵטְא״.
human_translation: because for this one it is not his way, and that one he degrades. But other women with whom relations are forbidden, whose way and their degradation is not great, say not the Merciful One wrote “sin”
llm_translation: Because this is not his way, and he is causing her harm. But for other forbidden relationships that are their way, and their harm is not significant, one might say no. The Merciful One wrote "sin."

hebrew_text: וְאִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״חֵטְא״, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא אֲפִילּוּ חַיָּיבֵי לָאוִין. כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״מָוֶת״.
human_translation: And had the Merciful One wrote “sin,” I would say even to women who are forbidden by prohibition, the Merciful One wrote “death,”
llm_translation: If the Merciful One wrote "sin," I would have said even those liable for negative commandments. The Merciful One wrote "death."

hebrew_text: וְאִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״מָוֶת״, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: חַיָּיבֵי מִיתוֹת בֵּית דִּין – אֵין, חַיָּיבֵי כָרֵיתוֹת – לָא. כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״חֵטְא״.
human_translation: And had the Merciful One wrote “death,” I would say those liable to a court death indeed liable to karet , not the Merciful One wrote “sin,”
llm_translation: If the Merciful One wrote "death," I would say: those liable to capital punishment - no, those liable to karet - yes. The Merciful One wrote "sin."

hebrew_text: וְלִכְתּוֹב רַחֲמָנָא ״חֵטְא מָוֶת״, וְלָא בָּעֵי ״נַעַר״ וְ״נַעֲרָה״? אִין, הָכִי נָמֵי. וְאֶלָּא ״נַעַר״ ״נַעֲרָה״? חַד לְמַעוֹטֵי עוֹבֵד עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה, וְחַד לְמַעוֹטֵי בְּהֵמָה וְשַׁבָּת.
human_translation: But let the Merciful One write “sin worthy of death” and no necessary na’ar “ na’ara .” Yes, is indeed so; But na’ar “ na’ara ” One to exclude someone who worship idols, and one to exclude an animal or Shabbat,
llm_translation: The text reads: "And to write 'a sin deserving death,' and not 'a young man' and 'a young woman'? No, it is thus. But rather 'a young man' 'a young woman'? One for excluding those engaged in idol worship, and one for excluding animals and Shabbat."

hebrew_text: וּלְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַי, דְּאָמַר: עוֹבֵד עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה נִיתָּן לְהַצִּילוֹ בְּנַפְשׁוֹ, לְמָה לִי? חַד לְמַעוֹטֵי בְּהֵמָה, וְחַד לְמַעוֹטֵי שַׁבָּת.
human_translation: And according to Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai, who says an idol worshipper must be saved at his life, why do I One to exclude an animal, and one to exclude Shabbat.
llm_translation: And for Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai, as he said: One who worships idols may be saved at the cost of his life, why do I need it? One for the exclusion of an animal, and one for the exclusion of Shabbat.

hebrew_text: סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: תֵּיתֵי שַׁבָּת מֵ״חִילּוּל״ ״חִילּוּל״ מֵעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה.
human_translation: enter your mind to say Shabbat derived from idol worship “desecration” “desecration”
llm_translation: I would say: One should establish Shabbat from "chilul" and "chilul" from idol worship.

hebrew_text: וּלְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, דְּאָמַר: מְחַלֵּל אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת נִיתָּן לְהַצִּילוֹ בְּנַפְשׁוֹ, דְּאָתְיָא שַׁבָּת מֵ״חִילּוּל״ ״חִילּוּל״ מֵעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר? חַד מִיעוּט לְמַעוֹטֵי בְּהֵמָה, וְאִידַּךְ – אַיְּידֵי דִּכְתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״נַעַר״, כְּתַב נָמֵי ״נַעֲרָה״.
human_translation: And according to Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, who says one who desecrate Shabbat must be saved at his life, because Shabbat derived from idol worship “desecration” “desecration” what is there to say? One exclusion to exclude an animal; and the other, since the Merciful One wrote na’ar , He also wrote “ na’ara .”
llm_translation: To Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, who said: One who desecrates the Sabbath, it is permitted to save him with his life, for the Sabbath comes from "desecration" to exclude idol worship. What can be said to limit this? One is to exclude domestic animals, and the other – since the Merciful One wrote "young man," He also wrote "young woman."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אַף הָאוֹמֶרֶת ״הַנִּיחוּ לוֹ״ שֶׁלֹּא יַהַרְגֶנָּה. בְּמַאי קָמִיפַּלְגִי?
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: Also, if says Let be, so that he should not kill her, With regard to what do they disagree?
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: Even she who says "let him leave her" so that he will not kill her. With what is he disagreeing?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: בְּמַקְפֶּדֶת עַל פִּיגְמָהּ, וּמַנִּיחָתוֹ שֶׁלֹּא יַהַרְגֶנָּה. רַבָּנַן סָבְרִי: אַפִּיגְמָא קָפֵיד רַחֲמָנָא, וַהֲרֵי מַקְפֶּדֶת עַל פִּיגְמָהּ. וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה: הַאי דְּקָאָמַר רַחֲמָנָא קַטְלֵיהּ – מִשּׁוּם דְּמָסְרָה נַפְשַׁהּ לִקְטָלָא. הָא לָא מָסְרָה נַפְשַׁהּ לִקְטָלָא.
human_translation: Rava says: where is particular about the degradation but allows him so that he should not kill her. The Rabbis maintain the Torah is particular about her degradation, and she is particular about her degradation. And Rabbi Yehuda that the Merciful One says must be killed because sacrifice her life woman this sacrifice her life,
llm_translation: Rava said: With insistence on her adornment, and leaving him so that he will not kill her. The Rabbis hold: Even adornment is a matter of Divine concern, and yet she insists on her adornment. And Rabbi Yehuda: What the Merciful One says, let him kill her - because she delivered herself to be killed. But she did not deliver herself to be killed.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב פָּפָּא לְאַבָּיֵי: אַלְמָנָה לְכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל נָמֵי קָא פָגֵים לַהּ! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַפִּיגְמָא רַבָּה קָפֵיד רַחֲמָנָא, אַפִּיגְמָא זוּטָא לָא קָפֵיד רַחֲמָנָא.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said to Abaye: a High Priest also degrades a widow said to For a great degradation, the Merciful One is particular; for a small degradation, the Merciful One is not particular.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Papa to Abbaye: A widow to a High Priest is he engaging with! He said to him: A great engagement the Merciful One is particular about, a small engagement the Merciful One is not particular about.

hebrew_text: ״חֵטְא״ – אֵלּוּ חַיָּיבֵי כָרֵיתוֹת. וּרְמִינְהוּ: וְאֵלּוּ נְעָרוֹת שֶׁיֵּשׁ לָהֶן קְנָס – הַבָּא עַל אֲחוֹתוֹ.
human_translation: “sin” liable to karet . raises a contradiction These are the young women for whom there is a fine to their One who engages in intercourse with his sister.
llm_translation: "Sin" - these are those liable for excisions. And they raised a dilemma: And these are young women who have a penalty - one who comes upon his sister.

hebrew_text: אַמְרוּהָ רַבָּנַן קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב חִסְדָּא: מִשְּׁעַת הַעֲרָאָה דְּפַגְמַהּ, אִיפְּטַר לֵהּ מִקְּטָלָא. מָמוֹנָא לָא מְשַׁלֵּם עַד גְּמַר בִּיאָה.
human_translation: The Sages stated before Rav Ḥisda: From the time of the initial stage of intercourse, when he has degraded her, he is exempt from being killed, But he does not pay money until the conclusion of intercourse,
llm_translation: The Sages said before Rav Ḥisda: From the moment of the blemish's appearance, he is exempt from the penalty of killing. The monetary payment is not due until the completion of intercourse.

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר: הַעֲרָאָה זוֹ נְשִׁיקָה, אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר: הַעֲרָאָה זוֹ הַכְנָסַת עֲטָרָה – מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר?
human_translation: This works out well according to the one who says the initial stage of intercourse is a kiss, But according to the one who said the initial stage of intercourse is the insertion of the corona, what is there to say?
llm_translation: The one who says: "Ha'ara'ah" means kissing, but the one who says: "Ha'ara'ah" means the insertion of the crown - what can be said?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: כְּגוֹן שֶׁבָּא עָלֶיהָ שֶׁלֹּא כְּדַרְכָּהּ, וְחָזַר וּבָא עָלֶיהָ כְּדַרְכָּהּ.
human_translation: Rather, Rav Ḥisda says: where engaged in intercourse with an atypical he again engaged in intercourse with her in a typical
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Ḥisdah said: For example, if one had relations with her not in the usual manner, and then he returned and had relations with her in the usual manner.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: בְּמַנִּיחָתוֹ, שֶׁלֹּא יַהַרְגֶנָּה, וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה הִיא.
human_translation: Rava says: where allows so that he should not kill her, and it is Rabbi Yehuda,
llm_translation: Rava said: In his leaving, that he not kill her, and Rabbi Yehuda agrees.

hebrew_text: רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר: בִּמְפוּתָּה, וְדִבְרֵי הַכֹּל.
human_translation: Rav Pappa says: with regard to seduced, and all agree
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: In Mefutah, and the words of everyone.

hebrew_text: אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: בְּיָכוֹל לְהַצִּיל בְּאֶחָד מֵאֵבָרָיו, וְרַבִּי יוֹנָתָן בֶּן שָׁאוּל הִיא. דְּתַנְיָא: רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן בֶּן שָׁאוּל אוֹמֵר, רוֹדֵף שֶׁהָיָה רוֹדֵף אַחַר חֲבֵירוֹ לְהוֹרְגוֹ, וְיָכוֹל לְהַצִּילוֹ בְּאֶחָד מֵאֵבָרָיו וְלֹא הִצִּיל – נֶהֱרָג עָלָיו.
human_translation: Abaye says: with regard to where able to save in one of his limbs, and it is Rabbi Yonatan ben Shaul. As it is taught Rabbi Yonatan ben Shaul says: a pursuer was pursuing another to kill him, and able to save in one of his limbs, but he did not save him he is executed on his account
llm_translation: Abaye said: If one can save a life with one of his limbs, and Rabbi Yonatan ben Sha'ul is the one who said it. As it was taught: Rabbi Yonatan ben Sha'ul says, a pursuer who was pursuing his fellow to kill him, and the pursued can save him with one of his limbs and did not save him - he is killed.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יוֹנָתָן בֶּן שָׁאוּל? דִּכְתִיב: ״וְכִי יִנָּצוּ אֲנָשִׁים (יַחְדָּו) וְגוֹ׳״. וְאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: בְּמַצּוּת שֶׁבְּמִיתָה הַכָּתוּב מְדַבַּר, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְאִם אָסוֹן יִהְיֶה וְנָתַתָּה נֶפֶשׁ תַּחַת נָפֶשׁ״. וַאֲפִילּוּ הָכִי אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא: ״וְלֹא יִהְיֶה אָסוֹן עָנוֹשׁ יֵעָנֵשׁ״.
human_translation: What is the reason of Rabbi Yonatan ben Shaul? As it is written: “If men strive And Rabbi Elazar says: The verse is speaking of striving to kill, that it is written: “But if any harm ensues, then you shall give life for life” And even so, the Merciful One states: “And yet no further harm ensues, he shall be punished,”
llm_translation: What is the reason for Rabbi Yonatan ben Sha'ul? As it is written: "And if men strive together (with each other) etc." And Rabbi Elazar said: In the commandment of capital punishment, the Scripture speaks, as it is written: "But if there is harm, then you shall give life for life." And even so, the Merciful One said: "But if there is no harm, he shall surely be punished."

hebrew_text: אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא: יָכוֹל לְהַצִּיל בְּאֶחָד מֵאֵבָרָיו, לֹא נִיתָּן לְהַצִּילוֹ בְּנַפְשׁוֹ – הַיְינוּ דְּמַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ דְּיֵעָנֵשׁ, כְּגוֹן שֶׁיָּכוֹל לְהַצִּיל בְּאֶחָד מֵאֵבָרָיו.
human_translation: Granted, if you say able to save in one of his limbs, he may not save at life, that is how you find that would be punished. where it was possible to save in one of his limbs.
llm_translation: If you say: "He can save with one of his limbs," he cannot save himself with his own life - this is like forgetting that he will be punished, for example, that he can save with one of his limbs.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, אִי אָמְרַתְּ: יָכוֹל לְהַצִּיל בְּאֶחָד מֵאֵבָרָיו נָמֵי נִיתָּן לְהַצִּילוֹ בְּנַפְשׁוֹ, הֵיכִי מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ דְּיֵעָנֵשׁ?
human_translation: But if you say able to save in one of his limbs, he can also save him at life, how can you find that would be punished?
llm_translation: Rather, if you say: Can one save with one of his limbs, indeed it is possible to save him with his life, how do you forget that he will be punished?

hebrew_text: דִּילְמָא שָׁאנֵי הָכָא, דְּמִיתָה לָזֶה וְתַשְׁלוּמִין לָזֶה.
human_translation: Perhaps it is different here because death is on account of this while payment is on account of that
llm_translation: Perhaps it is different here, for one dies and the payment is for another.

hebrew_text: לָא שְׁנָא, דְּאָמַר רָבָא: רוֹדֵף שֶׁהָיָה רוֹדֵף אַחַר חֲבֵירוֹ, וְשִׁיבֵּר אֶת הַכֵּלִים – בֵּין שֶׁל נִרְדׇּף וּבֵין שֶׁל כׇּל אָדָם – פָּטוּר. מַאי טַעְמָא? מִתְחַיֵּיב בְּנַפְשׁוֹ הוּא.
human_translation: is no difference. As Rava says: a pursuer was pursuing another and broke vessels either to the person being pursued or to anyone else, exempt What is the reason he is liable to be killed,
llm_translation: It is not different, for Rava said: A pursuer who was pursuing after his fellow, and broke the vessels - whether they belong to the pursuer or to any person - he is exempt. What is the reason? He is liable with his own life.

hebrew_text: וְנִרְדׇּף שֶׁשִּׁיבֵּר אֶת הַכֵּלִים שֶׁל רוֹדֵף – פָּטוּר, שֶׁל כׇּל אָדָם – חַיָּיב. שֶׁל רוֹדֵף פָּטוּר, שֶׁלֹּא יְהֵא מָמוֹנוֹ חָבִיב עָלָיו מִגּוּפוֹ. שֶׁל כׇּל אָדָם חַיָּיב, שֶׁמַּצִּיל עַצְמוֹ בְּמָמוֹן חֲבֵירוֹ.
human_translation: And the pursued broke vessels belonged to the pursuer, exempt. belonged to anyone liable belonged to the pursuer, exempt. so that the property should not be more precious to than his body. to anyone liable, as he saved himself at another’s property,
llm_translation: And one who breaks the vessels of a pursuer - exempt, those of any person - liable. Those of a pursuer exempt, for his money is not as dear to him as his body. Those of any person liable, for he saves himself with his fellow's money.

hebrew_text: וְרוֹדֵף שֶׁהָיָה רוֹדֵף אַחַר רוֹדֵף לְהַצִּילוֹ, וְשִׁיבֵּר אֶת הַכֵּלִים – בֵּין שֶׁל רוֹדֵף, בֵּין שֶׁל נִרְדׇּף, בֵּין שֶׁל כׇּל אָדָם – פָּטוּר. וְלֹא מִן הַדִּין, שֶׁאִם אִי אַתָּה אוֹמֵר כֵּן, נִמְצָא אֵין לָךְ כׇּל אָדָם שֶׁמַּצִּיל אֶת חֲבֵירוֹ מִיַּד הָרוֹדֵף.
human_translation: But pursuer was pursuing pursuer to save him, and he broke vessels either to the pursuer or to the one being pursued, or to anyone exempt is not by law, because if you do not say be found that no person will save another from a pursuer,
llm_translation: The pursuer who was pursuing to save him, and he broke the vessels - whether of the pursuer, whether of the pursued, whether of any person - he is exempt. And not from the law, for if you say so, you will find that there is no person who saves his fellow from the hand of the pursuer.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל הָרוֹדֵף אַחַר בְּהֵמָה, תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַי אוֹמֵר: הָעוֹבֵד עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה נִיתָּן לְהַצִּילוֹ בְּנַפְשׁוֹ, מִקַּל וָחוֹמֶר. וּמָה פְּגַם הֶדְיוֹט נִיתָּן לְהַצִּילוֹ בְּנַפְשׁוֹ, פְּגַם גָּבוֹהַּ לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן? וְכִי עוֹנְשִׁין מִן הַדִּין?! קָא סָבַר: עוֹנְשִׁין מִן הַדִּין.
human_translation: But one who pursues an animal It is taught Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai says: One who worship idols may be saved at his life. through an a fortiori If the degradation of an ordinary he can be saved at his life, all the more so not the degrading of God But does administer punishment on inference? maintains administers punishment on inference.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: But one who pursues after an animal, it was taught, Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai says: One who worships idolatry is given the option to save himself at the cost of his life, all the more so. And what blemish of a layman can he save himself at the cost of his life, a severe blemish, is it not all the more so? And is punishment from the court?! He thought: Punishment from the court. English translation:

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: הַמְחַלֵּל אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת נִיתָּן לְהַצִּילוֹ בְּנַפְשׁוֹ. סָבַר לַהּ כַּאֲבוּהּ, דְּאָמַר: עוֹנְשִׁין מִן הַדִּין. וְאָתְיָא שַׁבָּת בְּ״חִילּוּל״ ״חִילּוּל״ מֵעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה.
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, says: One who desecrate Shabbat may be saved at his life. holds in accordance with his father, who says: administers punishment on inference, and Shabbat is derived from idol worship “desecration” “desecration”
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, says: One who desecrates the Sabbath may be saved at the cost of his own life. He reasoned with her as follows: He holds that the punishment is from the court. And the Sabbath comes under the category of "desecration," "desecration" being a form of idolatry.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יְהוֹצָדָק: נִימְנוּ וְגָמְרוּ בַּעֲלִיַּת בֵּית נַתְּזָה בְּלוֹד, כׇּל עֲבֵירוֹת שֶׁבַּתּוֹרָה אִם אוֹמְרִין לָאָדָם ״עֲבוֹר וְאַל תֵּהָרֵג״ – יַעֲבוֹר וְאַל יֵהָרֵג, חוּץ מֵעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה וְגִילּוּי עֲרָיוֹת וּשְׁפִיכוּת דָּמִים.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yehotzadak: counted and concluded in the upper story of the house of Nitza in Lod: all transgressions in the Torah, if a person is told: Transgress and you will not be killed, he may transgress and not be killed, except for idol worship, forbidden sexual relations, and bloodshed.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yehotzadak: They counted and completed the construction of the house of the sprinkling in Lod. Regarding all transgressions in the Torah, if they say to a person, "Transgress and do not be killed," he should transgress and not be killed, except for idol worship, forbidden sexual relations, and shedding of blood.

hebrew_text: וַעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה לָא? וְהָא תַּנְיָא: אָמַר רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל, מִנַּיִן שֶׁאִם אָמְרוּ לוֹ לָאָדָם ״עֲבוֹד עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה וְאַל תֵּהָרֵג״, מִנַּיִן שֶׁיַּעֲבוֹד וְאַל יֵהָרֵג? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״וָחַי בָּהֶם״ – וְלֹא שֶׁיָּמוּת בָּהֶם.
human_translation: And not idol worship But isn’t it taught Rabbi Yishmael said: From where that if a person is told: Worship idols and you will not be killed, from where that he should worship and not be killed? The verse states: and he shall live by them” but not that die due to their
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And foreign worship not? And this teaches: Rabbi Yishmael said, From where do we know that if they say to a person, "Worship idolatry and do not be killed," from where do we know that he should worship and not be killed? Scripture teaches, "And live by them" - and not that he should die by them.

hebrew_text: יָכוֹל אֲפִילּוּ בְּפַרְהֶסְיָא? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְלֹא תְחַלְּלוּ אֶת שֵׁם קׇדְשִׁי וְנִקְדַּשְׁתִּי״.
human_translation: might even in public, the verse states: “Neither shall you profane My holy name; but I will be hallowed
llm_translation: I am able even in the marketplace? The Talmud teaches: "And you shall not profane My holy name, but I will be sanctified."

hebrew_text: אִינְהוּ דַּאֲמוּר כְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, דְּתַנְיָא: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: ״וְאָהַבְתָּ אֵת ה׳ אֱלֹהֶיךָ בְּכׇל לְבָבְךָ וּבְכׇל נַפְשְׁךָ וּבְכׇל מְאֹדֶךָ״. אִם נֶאֱמַר ״בְּכׇל נַפְשְׁךָ״, לָמָּה נֶאֱמַר ״בְּכׇל מְאֹדֶךָ״? וְאִם נֶאֱמַר ״בְּכׇל מְאֹדֶךָ״, לָמָּה נֶאֱמַר ״בְּכׇל נַפְשְׁךָ״?
human_translation: Those stated in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer. As it is taught Rabbi Eliezer says: “And you shall love the Lord your God with all your heart, with all your soul, and with all your might” If it is stated: “With all your soul,” why is it stated: “With all your might,” And if it is stated: “With all your might,” why is it stated: “With all your soul”?
llm_translation: They who say like Rabbi Eliezer, as it was taught: Rabbi Eliezer says, "And you shall love the Lord your God with all your heart, and with all your soul, and with all your might." If it is stated "with all your soul," why is it stated "with all your might"? And if it is stated "with all your might," why is it stated "with all your soul"?

hebrew_text: אִם יֵשׁ לְךָ אָדָם שֶׁגּוּפוֹ חָבִיב עָלָיו מִמָּמוֹנוֹ, לְכָךְ נֶאֱמַר ״בְּכׇל נַפְשְׁךָ״. וְאִם יֵשׁ לָךְ אָדָם שֶׁמָּמוֹנוֹ חָבִיב עָלָיו מִגּוּפוֹ, לְכָךְ נֶאֱמַר ״בְּכׇל מְאֹדֶךָ״.
human_translation: if you have a person whose body is more precious to him than his property, it is therefore stated: “With all your soul.” And if you have a person whose property is more precious to him than his body, it is therefore stated: “With all your might.”
llm_translation: If you have a person whose body is dearer to him than his money, regarding this it is stated, "With all your soul." And if you have a person whose money is dearer to him than his body, regarding this it is stated, "With all your might."

hebrew_text: גִּילּוּי עֲרָיוֹת וּשְׁפִיכוּת דָּמִים, כִּדְרַבִּי. דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: ״כִּי כַּאֲשֶׁר יָקוּם אִישׁ עַל רֵעֵהוּ וּרְצָחוֹ נֶפֶשׁ כֵּן הַדָּבָר הַזֶּה״. וְכִי מָה לָמַדְנוּ מֵרוֹצֵחַ?
human_translation: forbidden sexual relations and bloodshed? in accordance with of Rabbi As it is taught Rabbi says: for as when a man rises against his neighbor, and slays him, But what do we learn from a murderer?
llm_translation: Revealing forbidden relationships and shedding blood, as Rabbi. For it was taught: Rabbi says, "For as a man rises against his neighbor and murders him, so is this matter." And what have we learned from the murderer?

hebrew_text: מֵעַתָּה, הֲרֵי זֶה בָּא לְלַמֵּד וְנִמְצָא לָמֵד. מַקִּישׁ רוֹצֵחַ לְנַעֲרָה הַמְאוֹרָסָה: מָה נַעֲרָה הַמְאוֹרָסָה – נִיתָּן לְהַצִּילוֹ בְּנַפְשׁוֹ, אַף רוֹצֵחַ – נִיתָּן לְהַצִּילוֹ בְּנַפְשׁוֹ.
human_translation: Now, came to teach and it turns out it derives juxtaposes a murderer to a betrothed young woman just as one may save her at life, so too, a murderer, one may save at life.
llm_translation: From now on, behold, this one comes to teach and is found to have learned. He juxtaposes a murderer to a betrothed maiden: Just as a betrothed maiden - it is permitted to save her at the cost of his own life, so too a murderer - it is permitted to save him at the cost of his own life.

hebrew_text: וּמַקִּישׁ נַעֲרָה הַמְאוֹרָסָה לְרוֹצֵחַ: מָה רוֹצֵחַ יֵהָרֵג וְאַל יַעֲבוֹר, אַף נַעֲרָה הַמְאוֹרָסָה תֵּהָרֵג וְאַל תַּעֲבוֹר.
human_translation: And juxtaposes a betrothed young woman to a murderer just as murderer, he must be killed and not transgress so too, a betrothed young woman, she must be killed and not transgress
llm_translation: And he juxtaposes a betrothed maiden to a murderer: Just as a murderer is to be killed and not to transgress, so too a betrothed maiden is to be killed and not to transgress.

hebrew_text: רוֹצֵחַ גּוּפֵיהּ מְנָא לַן? סְבָרָא הוּא, דְּהָהוּא דַּאֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבָּה וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֲמַר לִי מָרֵי דּוּרַאי ״זִיל קַטְלֵיהּ לִפְלָנְיָא, וְאִי לָא קָטֵילְנָא לָךְ״. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לִקְטְלוּךָ וְלָא תִּיקְטוֹל. מִי יֵימַר דִּדְמָא דִּידָךְ סוּמָּק טְפֵי? דִּילְמָא דְּמָא דְּהוּא גַּבְרָא סוּמָּק טְפֵי.
human_translation: From where do we a murderer himself, It is logical reasoning As a certain person came before Rabba and said to him: The lord of my place, said to me: Go kill so-and-so, and if not I will kill you, said to him: he should kill you and you should not kill. Who is to say that your blood is redder Perhaps that man’s blood is redder.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: How do we establish the guilt of the murderer? It is a logical deduction, for the one who came before Rabba and said to him: "My master, so-and-so told me, 'Go kill such-and-such person, and if you do not kill him, I will kill you.'" He said to him: "Let him kill you, and you should not kill him." Who can say that your blood is redder? Perhaps the blood of that man is redder.

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא רַב דִּימִי, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא שֶׁלֹּא בִּשְׁעַת הַשְּׁמָד, אֲבָל בִּשְׁעַת הַשְּׁמָד, אֲפִילּוּ מִצְוָה קַלָּה – יֵהָרֵג וְאַל יַעֲבוֹר.
human_translation: When Rav Dimi came he said Rabbi Yoḥanan taught only when it is not a time of persecution. But in a time of persecution, even a minor mitzva, one must be killed and not transgress.
llm_translation: When Rav Dimi came, Rabbi Yochanan said: They only taught this regarding a time of destruction, but at a time of destruction, even a light commandment - one should be killed and not transgress.

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא רָבִין אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אֲפִילּוּ שֶׁלֹּא בִּשְׁעַת הַשְּׁמָד, לֹא אָמְרוּ אֶלָּא בְּצִינְעָא, אֲבָל בְּפַרְהֶסְיָא אֲפִילּוּ מִצְוָה קַלָּה – יֵהָרֵג וְאַל יַעֲבוֹר.
human_translation: When Ravin came Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Even when not a time of persecution, said only in private. But in public, even a minor mitzva, he must be killed and not transgress.
llm_translation: When Ravin came, Rabbi Yochanan said: Even if it is not during the time of destruction, they only said it in secret, but in public, even for a light mitzvah - one should be killed rather than transgress.

hebrew_text: מַאי מִצְוָה קַלָּה? אָמַר רָבָא בַּר רַב יִצְחָק אָמַר רַב:
human_translation: What is a minor mitzva Rava bar Yitzḥak says Rav says:
llm_translation: What is a light commandment? Rava son of Rav Yitzchak said Rav:

hebrew_text: אֲפִילּוּ לְשַׁנּוֹיֵי עַרְקְתָא דִּמְסָאנָא.
human_translation: Even to change the strap of a sandal.
llm_translation: Even to the language of the Arameans of Damascus.

hebrew_text: וְכַמָּה פַּרְהֶסְיָא? אָמַר רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אֵין פַּרְהֶסְיָא פְּחוּתָה מֵעֲשָׂרָה בְּנֵי אָדָם. פְּשִׁיטָא, יִשְׂרְאֵלִים בָּעֵינַן, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְנִקְדַּשְׁתִּי בְּתוֹךְ בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל״. בָּעֵי רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה: תִּשְׁעָה יִשְׂרָאֵל וְגוֹי אֶחָד, מַהוּ?
human_translation: And how many a public Rabbi Ya’akov says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: not a public fewer than ten people. obvious we require Jews, as it is written “And I shall be sanctified among the children of Israel” Rabbi Yirmeya asks: What is nine Jews and one gentile
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And how much is a Peras? Rabbi Yaakov said, Rabbi Yochanan said: A Peras is not less than ten people. It is obvious, we require Israelites, as it is written: 'And I will be sanctified among the children of Israel.' Rabbi Yirmeya asked: Nine Israelites and one non-Jew, what is the law?"

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּתָנֵי רַב יַנַּאי אֲחוּהּ דְּרַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא: אָתְיָא ״תּוֹךְ״ ״תּוֹךְ״ – כְּתִיב הָכָא: ״וְנִקְדַּשְׁתִּי בְּתוֹךְ בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם: ״הִבָּדְלוּ מִתּוֹךְ הָעֵדָה הַזֹּאת״. מָה לְהַלָּן עֲשָׂרָה וְכוּלְּהוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל, אַף כָּאן עֲשָׂרָה וְכוּלְּהוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל.
human_translation: Come hear Rav Yannai, the brother of Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba, teaches derived “among” “among” Here, it is written: “And I shall be sanctified among the children of Israel,” and there, it is written: “Separate yourselves from among this congregation” Just as there, ten, and all Jews, so too here, ten, all of them Jews.
llm_translation: Come and hear, as it was taught by Rav Yannai, the brother-in-law of Rabbi Chiya bar Abba: It comes "within" "within" - it is written here: "And I will be sanctified among the children of Israel," and it is written there: "Separate yourselves from within this congregation." Just as there, there were ten, and all of them were Israel, so too here, there are ten, and all of them are Israel.

hebrew_text: וְהָא אֶסְתֵּר פַּרְהֶסְיָא הֲוַאי? אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: אֶסְתֵּר קַרְקַע עוֹלָם הָיְתָה.
human_translation: But wasn’t Esther, a public Abaye says: Esther was natural ground,
llm_translation: And the Esther Parhesya, what is it? Abaye said: Esther was the foundation of the world.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: הֲנָאַת עַצְמָן שָׁאנֵי.
human_translation: Rava says their personal pleasure, is different.
llm_translation: Rava said: The benefit of themselves is different.

hebrew_text: דְּאִי לָא תֵּימָא הָכִי, הָנֵי קְוָואקֵי וְדֵימוֹנִיקֵי הֵיכִי יָהֲבִינַן לְהוּ? אֶלָּא הֲנָאַת עַצְמָן שָׁאנֵי. הָכָא נָמֵי, הֲנָאַת עַצְמָן שָׁאנֵי.
human_translation: As if you do not say so, how do we give them coal shovels [ kevakei vedimonikei ]? Rather, personal pleasure is different. Here too, personal pleasure is different,
llm_translation: If you don't say so, how would those Kevaukei and Deimonikei understand? Rather, their own benefit is different. Here, their own benefit is different.

hebrew_text: וְאַזְדָּא רָבָא לְטַעְמֵיהּ, דְּאָמַר רָבָא: גּוֹי דְּאָמַר לֵיהּ לְהַאי יִשְׂרָאֵל, ״קְטוֹל אַסְפַּסְתָּא בְּשַׁבְּתָא וּשְׁדִי לְחֵיוָתָא, וְאִי לָא קָטֵילְנָא לָךְ״ – לִיקְטוֹל וְלָא לִקְטְלֵיהּ. ״שְׁדִי לְנַהְרָא״ – לִיקְטְלֵיהּ וְלָא לִיקְטוֹל. מַאי טַעְמָא? לְעַבּוֹרֵי מִילְּתָא קָא בָּעֵי.
human_translation: And Rava follows his reasoning, as Rava says: If a gentile said to a certain Jew: Cut grass [ aspasta ] on Shabbat and throw it before the cattle, and if do not I will kill you, he should cut and not be killed. throw it into the river, he should be killed and not cut What is the reason he wants to violate religion.
llm_translation: And Rava went according to his reasoning, for Rava said: A non-Jew who said to this Jew, "Cut off a piece of meat on Shabbat and throw it to the lion, and if not, I will kill you" – he should cut it and not kill him. "Throw it into the river" – he should kill him and not throw it. What is the reason? He seeks to transgress a matter of importance.

hebrew_text: בְּעוֹ מִינֵּיהּ מֵרַבִּי אַמֵּי: בֵּן נֹחַ מְצוֶּּוה עַל קְדוּשַּׁת הַשֵּׁם, אוֹ אֵין מְצוֶּּוה עַל קְדוּשַּׁת הַשֵּׁם?
human_translation: raised a dilemma before Rabbi Ami: a descendant of Noah, commanded about the sanctification of God’s name, or is he not commanded about the sanctification of God’s name?
llm_translation: Inquired of him Rabbi Ammi: A Ben Noach commanded regarding the sanctity of the Name, or not commanded regarding the sanctity of the Name?

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי, תָּא שְׁמַע: שֶׁבַע מִצְוֹת נִצְטַוּוּ בְּנֵי נֹחַ. וְאִם אִיתָא, תַּמְנֵי הָוְיָין! אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא: אִינְהוּ וְכֹל אַבְזְרַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: Abaye says: Come hear Descendants of Noah were commanded seven mitzvot: And if it is so there would be eight Rava said to him: themselves with all their associated [ avzaraihu ]
llm_translation: Abaye said, "Come and hear: Seven commandments were commanded to the sons of Noah. And if you wish, say, 'There are eight!' Rava said to him: They and all their accessories."

hebrew_text: מַאי הָוֵי עֲלַהּ? אָמַר רַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה: אָמְרִי בֵּי רַב, כְּתִיב: ״לַדָּבָר הַזֶּה יִסְלַח ה׳ לְעַבְדֶּךָ בְּבוֹא אֲדֹנִי בֵית רִמּוֹן לְהִשְׁתַּחֲוֹת שָׁמָּה וְהוּא נִשְׁעָן עַל יָדִי וְהִשְׁתַּחֲוֵיתִי״, וּכְתִיב: ״וַיֹּאמֶר לוֹ לֵךְ לְשָׁלוֹם״.
human_translation: What was about Rav Adda bar Ahava says they say the school of Rav: It is written “For this matter may the Lord pardon your servant, that when my master goes into the house of Rimmon to bow down there and he leans on my hand, and I bow myself down And it is written “And he said to him: Go in peace,”
llm_translation: What is the meaning of "עֲלַהּ"? Rav Adda bar Ahava said: The students of Rav said, as it is written: "For this thing, Hashem will forgive your servant when my lord comes to the house of Rimmon to bow there, and he leans on my hand, and I bow down." And it is written: "And he said to him, 'Go in peace.'"

hebrew_text: וְאִם אִיתָא, לָא לֵימָא לֵיהּ? הָא בְּצִנְעָה, הָא בְּפַרְהֶסְיָא.
human_translation: And if it is so he should not have said to him: This in private. that in public,
llm_translation: And if it is present, should it not be said to him? Here in private, there in public.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּאָדָם אֶחָד שֶׁנָּתַן עֵינָיו בְּאִשָּׁה אַחַת, וְהֶעֱלָה לִבּוֹ טִינָא. וּבָאוּ וְשָׁאֲלוּ לָרוֹפְאִים, וְאָמְרוּ: אֵין לוֹ תַּקָּנָה עַד שֶׁתִּבָּעֵל. אָמְרוּ חֲכָמִים: יָמוּת וְאַל תִּבָּעֵל לוֹ. תַּעֲמוֹד לְפָנָיו עֲרוּמָּה: יָמוּת וְאַל תַּעֲמוֹד לְפָנָיו עֲרוּמָּה. תְּסַפֵּר עִמּוֹ מֵאֲחוֹרֵי הַגָּדֵר: יָמוּת וְלֹא תְּסַפֵּר עִמּוֹ מֵאֲחוֹרֵי הַגָּדֵר.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Rav says: an incident involving a certain man who set his eyes upon a certain woman and passion rose in his heart, And they came and asked doctors And said: He will have no cure until she engages in sexual intercourse The Sages said: Let him die, and she may not engage in sexual intercourse with him. She should stand naked before him. Let him die, and she may not stand naked before him. should converse with him behind a fence Let him die, and she may not converse with him behind a fence.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: There was an incident with a certain man who set his eyes on one woman, and his heart became inflamed. They went and consulted the physicians, who said: He will not find a cure until he marries her. The sages said: Let him die and not marry her. Stand naked before him: Let him die and not stand naked before him. Count with him from behind the fence: Let him die and not count with him from behind the fence.

hebrew_text: פְּלִיגִי בַּהּ רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב בַּר אִידֵּי וְרַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי: חַד אָמַר: אֵשֶׁת אִישׁ הָיְתָה, וְחַד אָמַר: פְּנוּיָה הָיְתָה. בִּשְׁלָמָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר אֵשֶׁת אִישׁ הָיְתָה – שַׁפִּיר, אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר פְּנוּיָה הָיְתָה – מַאי כּוּלֵּי הַאי?
human_translation: Rabbi Ya’akov bar Idi and Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani disagree about One says: was a married woman, and one says: She was unmarried. Granted, according to the one who says she was a married woman, properly But according to the one who says she was unmarried, what is all this
llm_translation: They disputed it: Rabbi Yaakov bar Idi and Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani. One said: She was a married woman, and one said: She was unmarried. It is understandable according to the one who said she was a married woman – that is reasonable. But according to the one who said she was unmarried – what is the reasoning for this?

hebrew_text: רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר: מִשּׁוּם פְּגַם מִשְׁפָּחָה. רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִיקָא אָמַר: כְּדֵי שֶׁלֹּא יְהוּ בְּנוֹת יִשְׂרָאֵל פְּרוּצוֹת בַּעֲרָיוֹת.
human_translation: Rav Pappa says: due to family flaw, Rav Aḥa, son of Rav Ika, says: so that the daughters of Israel should not be promiscuous with regard to forbidden sexual relations.
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: because of a blemish in the family. Rav Acha, son of Rav Ika, said: in order that the daughters of Israel not be promiscuous in their cities.

hebrew_text: וְלִינְסְבַהּ מִינְסָב? לָא מְיַיתְּבָה דַּעְתֵּיהּ, כִּדְרַבִּי יִצְחָק. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: מִיּוֹם שֶׁחָרַב בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ, נִיטְּלָה טַעַם בִּיאָה וְנִיתְּנָה לְעוֹבְרֵי עֲבֵירָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״מַיִם גְּנוּבִים יִמְתָּקוּ וְלֶחֶם סְתָרִים יִנְעָם״.
human_translation: But let marry her. His mind would not have been eased in accordance with of Rabbi Yitzḥak. As Rabbi Yitzḥak says: Since the day the Temple was destroyed, sexual pleasure was taken away and given to transgressors, as it is stated: “Stolen waters are sweet, and bread eaten in secret is pleasant”
llm_translation: And to marry her off to a non-Jew? It is not established in his mind, as Rabbi Yitzchak said: From the day the Temple was destroyed, the taste of marital relations was removed and given to transgressors, as it is said, "Stolen waters are sweet, and bread eaten in secret is pleasant."

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ בֵּן סוֹרֵר וּמוֹרֶה.
llm_translation: We will return to you, Ben Sorer u'Moreh.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ וְאֵלּוּ הֵן הַנִּשְׂרָפִין : הַבָּא עַל אִשָּׁה וּבִתָּהּ, וּבַת כֹּהֵן שֶׁזִּנְּתָה.
human_translation: And these are who are burned One who engaged in intercourse with a woman and her daughter, and the daughter of a priest who committed adultery.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: And these are the ones who are burned: One who has relations with a married woman and her daughter, and the daughter of a priest who engaged in promiscuous behavior.

hebrew_text: יֵשׁ בִּכְלַל אִשָּׁה וּבִתָּהּ: בִּתּוֹ, וּבַת בִּתּוֹ, וּבַת בְּנוֹ, וּבַת אִשְׁתּוֹ, וּבַת בִּתָּהּ, וּבַת בְּנָהּ, חֲמוֹתוֹ, וְאֵם חֲמוֹתוֹ, וְאֵם חָמִיו.
human_translation: in the category of a woman and her daughter there are: His daughter, and the daughter of his daughter, and the daughter of his son. the daughter of his wife, and the daughter of her daughter, and the daughter of her son, his mother-in-law, and the mother of his mother-in-law, and the mother of his father-in-law.
llm_translation: There is included a woman and her daughter: her daughter, and her granddaughter, and her great-granddaughter, and her daughter-in-law, and her granddaughter's daughter, and her grandson's daughter, her mother-in-law, and her husband's mother, and her father-in-law.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ הַבָּא עַל אִשָּׁה שֶׁנָּשָׂא בִּתָּהּ – לָא קָתָנֵי, אֶלָּא הַבָּא עַל אִשָּׁה וּבִתָּהּ. מִכְּלָל דְּתַרְוַיְיהוּ לְאִיסּוּרָא, וּמַאן נִינְהוּ? חֲמוֹתוֹ וְאֵם חֲמוֹתוֹ.
human_translation: does not teach one who engaged in intercourse with a woman whose daughter he married. Rather, one who engaged in intercourse with a woman and her daughter. By inference, that both for a prohibition And who are these his mother-in-law and the mother of his mother-in-law.
llm_translation: The text states: "If a man has relations with his daughter-in-law - it does not teach this case, rather it teaches if one has relations with a woman and her daughter. From the fact that both are included in the prohibition, who are they? His mother-in-law and his wife's mother."

hebrew_text: וְקָתָנֵי: ״יֵשׁ בִּכְלַל אִשָּׁה וּבִתָּהּ״, מִכְּלָל דְּתַרְוַיְיהוּ כְּתִיבִי בְּהֶדְיָא, וְהָנָךְ מִדְּרָשָׁא אָתְיָא.
human_translation: And teaches: in the category of a woman and her daughter. By inference, that both are written explicitly and those are derived by interpretation.
llm_translation: "And it was taught: 'There is included a woman and her daughter,' from the inclusion of both of them it is written explicitly, and therefrom comes the teaching."

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לְאַבָּיֵי, דְּאָמַר: מַשְׁמָעוּת דּוֹרְשִׁין אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ. מַתְנִיתִין מַנִּי? רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא הִיא.
human_translation: This works out well according to Abaye, who says between their the interpretation of the meaning whose the mishna? It is Rabbi Akiva.
llm_translation: He left it to Abbaye, for he said: There is a difference in their interpretation. Is there a Mishnah from him? It is Rabbi Akiva.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְרָבָא דְּאָמַר: חֲמוֹתוֹ לְאַחַר מִיתָה אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ, מַתְנִיתִין מַנִּי? אָמַר לָךְ רָבָא: תְּנִי ״הַבָּא עַל אִשָּׁה שֶׁנָּשָׂא בִּתָּהּ״.
human_translation: But according to Rava, who says between their mother-in-law after death whose the mishna? Rava say to you: teach: One who engaged in intercourse with a woman whose daughter he married.
llm_translation: Rather, according to Rava who said: Is there a distinction between his mother-in-law after death, Mishnaic teaching from where? Rava said to you: Teach "He who comes upon a woman and marries her daughter."

hebrew_text: יֵשׁ בִּכְלַל אִשָּׁה וּבִתָּהּ: חֲמוֹתוֹ, וְאֵם חֲמוֹתוֹ, וְאֵם חָמִיו. לְאַבָּיֵי, אַיְּידֵי דְּקָא בָּעֵי לְמִיתְנֵא אֵם חָמִיו, תָּנֵי נָמֵי חֲמוֹתוֹ וְאֵם חֲמוֹתוֹ.
human_translation: in the category of a woman and her daughter there are: His mother-in-law, and the mother of his mother-in-law, and the mother of his father-in-law. according to Abaye, since seeks to teach the mother of his father-in-law he teaches his mother-in-law and the mother of his mother-in-law as well,
llm_translation: There is included a woman and her daughter: her mother-in-law, and the mother of her mother-in-law, and the mother of her father-in-law. According to Abbaye, since he wants to teach the mother of her father-in-law, he also teaches the mother-in-law and the mother of her mother-in-law.

hebrew_text: לְרָבָא, אַיְּידֵי דְּקָא בָּעֵי לְמִיתְנֵא אֵם חָמִיו וְאֵם חֲמוֹתוֹ, תָּנֵי נָמֵי חֲמוֹתוֹ.
human_translation: according to Rava, since seeks to teach the mother of his father-in-law and the mother of his mother-in-law he teaches his mother-in-law as well,
llm_translation: To Rav, since he wants to teach about his father-in-law and his mother-in-law, he should also teach about his mother-in-law.

hebrew_text: מְנָהָנֵי מִילֵּי? דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״אִישׁ אֲשֶׁר יִקַּח אֶת אִשָּׁה וְאֶת אִמָּהּ״ – אֵין לִי אֶלָּא אִשָּׁה וְאִמָּהּ. בַּת אִשָּׁה, וּבַת בִּתָּהּ, וּבַת בְּנָהּ מִנַּיִן?
human_translation: From where are these matters as the Sages taught: if a man takes a woman and her mother, I have only a woman and her mother. From where the daughter of woman or the daughter of her daughter, or the daughter of her son,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Menahanei milei? D'tanu Rabbanan: 'Ish asher yikach et isha ve'et immah' - ein li ela isha ve'immah. Bat isha, u'bat bitah, u'bat bintah minayin?" English translation: "What are the implications? The Rabbis taught: 'A man who takes a wife and her mother' - I have only a wife and her mother. How do we know about a daughter of a wife, a daughter of her daughter, and a daughter of her son?"

hebrew_text: נֶאֱמַר כָּאן ״זִמָּה״, וְנֶאֱמַר לְהַלָּן ״זִמָּה״. מָה לְהַלָּן – בִּתָּהּ וּבַת בִּתָּהּ וּבַת בְּנָהּ, אַף כָּאן – בִּתָּהּ וּבַת בִּתָּהּ וּבַת בְּנָהּ.
human_translation: Lewdness is stated here, and lewdness is stated there, just as there daughter, and the daughter of her daughter, and the daughter of her son, so too here, daughter, and the daughter of her daughter, and the daughter of her son.
llm_translation: It is stated here "zimah," and it is stated there "zimah." Just as there - her daughter, and her granddaughter, and her great-granddaughter, so too here - her daughter, and her granddaughter, and her great-granddaughter.

hebrew_text: מִנַּיִן לַעֲשׂוֹת זְכָרִים כִּנְקֵבוֹת? נֶאֱמַר כָּאן ״זִמָּה״, וְנֶאֱמַר לְהַלָּן ״זִמָּה״. מָה לְהַלָּן זְכָרִים כִּנְקֵבוֹת, אַף כָּאן זְכָרִים כִּנְקֵבוֹת.
human_translation: From where to render males like females Lewdness is stated here and lewdness is stated there. Just as there, males like female so too here, males like females.
llm_translation: From where do we derive to make males like females? It is stated here "zimah," and it is stated elsewhere "zimah." Just as there, males are like females, so too here, males are like females.

hebrew_text: מִנַּיִן לַעֲשׂוֹת לְמַטָּה כִּלְמַעְלָה? נֶאֱמַר כָּאן ״זִמָּה״, וְנֶאֱמַר לְהַלָּן ״זִמָּה״. מָה לְהַלָּן לְמַטָּה כִּלְמַעְלָה, אַף כָּאן לְמַטָּה כִּלְמַעְלָה. וּמָה כָּאן לְמַעְלָה כִּלְמַטָּה, אַף לְהַלָּן לְמַעְלָה כִּלְמַטָּה.
human_translation: From where to render below like above? Lewdness is stated here and lewdness is stated there. Just as there, below like above, so too here, below like above. And just as here, above like below, so too there, above like below.
llm_translation: From where do we derive to do below as above? It is stated here "zimah," and it is stated there "zimah." Just as there, below as above, so too here, below as above. And just as here, above as below, so too there, above as below.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: מִנַּיִן לַעֲשׂוֹת זְכָרִים כִּנְקֵבוֹת. מַאי ״זְכָרִים כִּנְקֵבוֹת״? אִילֵּימָא בַּת בְּנָהּ כְּבַת בִּתָּהּ? בַּהֲדֵי הֲדָדֵי קָאָתְיָאן!
human_translation: The Master says: From where to render males like females? What males like females? If we say daughter of the son of like the daughter of her daughter, are derived together
llm_translation: Master said: From where do we know to make males like females. What is "males like females"? If you say, a daughter should inherit like a daughter of a daughter? They are both coming together!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, אֵם חָמִיו כְּאֵם חֲמוֹתוֹ. הַשְׁתָּא, אֵם חֲמוֹתוֹ לָא קָמָה לַן, אֵם חָמִיו מִיהְדָּר עֲלַהּ?
human_translation: Rather, the mother of his father-in-law like the mother of his mother-in-law. Now, we have not established the mother of his mother-in-law, is seeking the mother of his father-in-law
llm_translation: Rather, if his mother-in-law is like his mother. Now, if his mother-in-law did not stand for us, should his mother come and dwell with us?

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: הָכִי קָאָמַר, מִנַּיִן לַעֲשׂוֹת שְׁאֵר הַבָּא מִמֶּנּוּ כִּשְׁאָר הַבָּא מִמֶּנָּה? נֶאֱמַר כָּאן ״זִמָּה״ וְנֶאֱמַר לְהַלָּן ״זִמָּה״ וְכוּ׳. וְהָא בִּשְׁאֵר דִּידֵיהּ לָא כְּתִיבָא בֵּיהּ ״זִמָּה״!
human_translation: Abaye says: This is saying. From where to render a relative who comes from his like a relative who comes from her Lewdness is stated here and lewdness is stated there. But isn’t with regard to a relative from his lewdness is not written,
llm_translation: Abaye said: Thus he said, from where to do the same with other that comes from it as with the other that comes from it? It is stated here "zimah" and it is stated there "zimah" and so forth. But in the other case of ours, "zimah" is not written in it!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: אֲמַר לִי רַב יִצְחָק בַּר אֲבוּדִימִי, אָתְיָא ״הֵנָּה״ ״הֵנָּה״, אָתְיָא ״זִמָּה״ ״זִמָּה״.
human_translation: Rava says: Rav Yitzḥak bar Avudimi said to me: derived “ henna ” “ henna ” derived “lewdness” “lewdness”
llm_translation: Rava said: Rav Yitzchak bar Avudimi told me, "Hinei, hinei" comes, "Zimah, zimah" comes.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: מִנַּיִן לַעֲשׂוֹת לְמַטָּה כִּלְמַעְלָה. מַאי ״לְמַטָּה כִּלְמַעְלָה״? אִילֵּימָא בַּת בְּנָהּ וּבַת בִּתָּהּ כְּבִתָּהּ, בַּהֲדֵי הֲדָדֵי קָאָתְיָין!
human_translation: The Master says: From where to render below like above? What below like above? If we say the daughter of the son of and the daughter of her daughter like her daughter, they are derived together,
llm_translation: Master said: From where do we derive to do below like above. What is "below like above"? If you say, a daughter of her son and a daughter of her daughter like her daughter, they are coming together in the same place!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, אֵם חָמִיו וְאֵם חֲמוֹתוֹ כַּחֲמוֹתוֹ. הַאי ״לְמַטָּה כִּלְמַעְלָה״? ״לְמַעְלָה כִּלְמַטָּה״ הוּא! תְּנִי: ״לְמַעְלָה כִּלְמַטָּה״.
human_translation: Rather, mother of his father-in-law and the mother of his mother-in-law is like his mother-in-law. this below is like above? it is above is like below. teach: above is like below
llm_translation: Rather, if his father-in-law and his mother-in-law are like his father-in-law. Is this "from below upwards"? It is "from above downwards"! It was taught: "from above downwards."

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, נֶאֱמַר כָּאן ״זִמָּה״ וְנֶאֱמַר לְהַלָּן ״זִמָּה״, וּמָה הַשְׁתָּא: אִינְהִי לָא כְּתִיבָא, זִמָּה דִּידְהוּ כְּתִיבָא?
human_translation: If so, Lewdness is stated here, and lewdness is stated there, now, if are not written lewdness written concerning them?
llm_translation: Thus, it was stated: here it says "zimah" and it says there "zimah." And now: is it not as it is written, their zimah is written?

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: הָכִי קָאָמַר, מִנַּיִן לַעֲשׂוֹת שְׁלֹשָׁה דּוֹרוֹת לְמַעְלָה כִּשְׁלֹשָׁה דּוֹרוֹת לְמַטָּה? נֶאֱמַר לְמַטָּה ״זִמָּה״ וְנֶאֱמַר לְמַעְלָה ״זִמָּה״. מָה לְמַטָּה שְׁלֹשָׁה דּוֹרוֹת, אַף לְמַעְלָה שְׁלֹשָׁה דּוֹרוֹת.
human_translation: Abaye says: This is saying: From where to render three generations above, like three generations below, Lewdness is stated below, and lewdness is stated above, Just as below, three generations so too above, three generations
llm_translation: Abaye said: Thus he said, from where to do three generations above like three generations below? It is said below "zimah" and it is said above "zimah." Just as below three generations, so too above three generations.

hebrew_text: וּמָה בָּעוֹנֶשׁ עָשָׂה לְמַטָּה כִּלְמַעְלָה, אַף בָּאַזְהָרָה נָמֵי עָשָׂה לְמַעְלָה כִּלְמַטָּה.
human_translation: And just as with regard to punishment, rendered below like above, so too, with regard to prohibition, rendered above like below.
llm_translation: "And what punishment did he who transgressed below receive, so too did he who transgressed above receive; just as with the warning below, so too with the warning above."

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: לְעוֹלָם כִּדְקָתָנֵי, וּמַאי ״לְמַטָּה״? לְמַטָּה בְּאִיסּוּר.
human_translation: Rav Ashi says: Actually, as it is taught. And what is below? below of prohibition,
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: Always as it is taught, and what is "below"? Below in prohibition.

hebrew_text: אִי: מָה הִיא – אֵם אִמָּהּ אֲסוּרָה, אַף הוּא – אֵם אִמּוֹ אֲסוּרָה?
human_translation: If Just as the mother of the mother of is forbidden so too the mother of his mother is forbidden
llm_translation: אִי: - If, מָה - what, הִיא - she, אֵם - mother, אִמָּהּ - her mother, אֲסוּרָה - forbidden, אַף - also, הוּא - he, אֵם - mother, אִמּוֹ - his mother, אֲסוּרָה - forbidden?

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: אָמַר קְרָא ״אִמְּךָ הִיא״, מִשּׁוּם אִמּוֹ אַתָּה מְחַיְּיבוֹ, וְאִי אַתָּה מְחַיְּיבוֹ מִשּׁוּם אֵם אִמּוֹ.
human_translation: Abaye says the verse states: she is your mother, Due to his mother you deem him liable but you do not deem him liable due to the mother of his mother.
llm_translation: Abaye said: The verse says, "She is your mother," because of his mother you are obligated to honor him, and if you are not obligated to honor him because of his mother, you are obligated to honor him because of his father's mother.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: בֵּין לְמַאן דְּאָמַר ״דּוּן מִינַּהּ וּמִינַּהּ״, וּבֵין לְמַאן דְּאָמַר ״דּוּן מִינַּהּ וְאוֹקֵי בְאַתְרַהּ״ – לָא אָתְיָא.
human_translation: Rava says: Both according to the one who says Infer from it, and from it, and according to the one who says: Infer from it but interpret to its place, is not derived
llm_translation: Rava said: Between the one who says "judge each one separately" and the one who says "judge each one and combine them" - it does not come.

hebrew_text: לְמַאן דְּאָמַר: דּוּן מִינַּהּ וּמִינַּהּ, מָה הִיא אֵם אִמָּהּ אֲסוּרָה – אַף הוּא נָמֵי אֵם אִמּוֹ אֲסוּרָה. וּמִינַּהּ: מָה הִיא בִּשְׂרֵיפָה – אַף הוּא נָמֵי בִּשְׂרֵיפָה.
human_translation: According to the one who says: Infer from it and from it, Just as the mother of her mother is forbidden so too his the mother of his mother is forbidden And from it: Just as by burning so too his also by burning
llm_translation: To whom says: judge from her and from her, what is if her mother forbidden - also he similarly if his mother forbidden. And from her: what is in burning - also he similarly in burning.

hebrew_text: לְמַאן דְּאָמַר: שְׂרֵיפָה חֲמוּרָה, אִיכָּא לְמִיפְרַךְ. מָה לְהִיא – שֶׁכֵּן אִמָּהּ בִּשְׂרֵיפָה, תֹּאמַר בְּהוּא – שֶׁאִמּוֹ בִּסְקִילָה?
human_translation: According to the one who says: burning is severe can be refuted What about her in that the mother of by burning, Will you say with regard to his where his mother by stoning?
llm_translation: To whom says: burning severe, there is to refute. What to her - that so her mother in burning, say in that - that her mother in stoning?

hebrew_text: וְעוֹד: אִמּוֹ בִּסְקִילָה, אֵם אִמּוֹ בִּשְׂרֵיפָה?
human_translation: And furthermore, his mother by stoning, the mother of his mother, by burning?
llm_translation: And furthermore: his mother was punished by stoning, but his mother was punished by burning?

hebrew_text: וְעוֹד: מָה הִיא – לֹא חִלַּקְתָּ בָּהּ בֵּין אִמָּהּ לְאֵם אִמָּהּ, אַף הוּא – נָמֵי לָא תַּחְלוֹק בּוֹ בֵּין אִמּוֹ לְאֵם אִמּוֹ?
human_translation: And furthermore, just as her you did not distinguish between her mother and the mother of her mother, so too his you should not distinguish between his mother and the mother of his mother.
llm_translation: And furthermore: What is it? - You did not differentiate in it between her mother and her stepmother, so too - should you not differentiate in him between his mother and his stepmother?

hebrew_text: וּלְמַאן דְּאָמַר סְקִילָה חֲמוּרָה, מֵהַאי קוּשְׁיָא לָא נְידוּנַהּ.
human_translation: And according to the one who says stoning is severe due to this difficulty, is not derived.
llm_translation: And for the one who says stoning is severe, from this question it is not resolved.

hebrew_text: וּלְמַאן דְּאָמַר, דּוּן מִינַּהּ וְאוֹקֵי בְאַתְרַהּ: מָה הִיא – אֵם אִמָּהּ אֲסוּרָה, אַף הוּא נָמֵי – אֵם אִמּוֹ אֲסוּרָה. וְאוֹקֵי בְּאַתְרַהּ: הָתָם הוּא דְּבִשְׂרֵיפָה, אֲבָל הָכָא בִּסְקִילָה, כִּדְאַשְׁכְּחַן בְּאִמּוֹ.
human_translation: And according to the one who says: Infer from it but interpret to its place, Just as the mother of her mother is forbidden so too his the mother of his mother is forbidden And interpret to its place: It is there, that by burning; but here, by stoning, as we found with regard to his mother.
llm_translation: And for the one who says, judge her and establish her lineage: what is it - if her mother is forbidden, so too he is forbidden. And establish her lineage: there it is in the case of burning, but here in the case of stoning, as it is found in his mother.

hebrew_text: לְמַאן דְּאָמַר שְׂרֵיפָה חֲמוּרָה, אִיכָּא לְמִיפְרַךְ:
human_translation: According to the one who says burning is severe can be refuted:
llm_translation: To whom that said burning is severe, there is room to differentiate.

hebrew_text: מָה לְהִיא – שֶׁכֵּן אִמָּהּ בִּשְׂרֵפָה, תֹּאמַר בְּהוּא – שֶׁאִמּוֹ בִּסְקִילָה?
human_translation: What about her in that the mother of by burning. Will you say with regard to his where his mother by stoning?
llm_translation: What about Heia - that her mother was burned, you will say in Hu - that his mother was stoned?

hebrew_text: וְעוֹד, הוּא כְּהִיא: מָה הִיא – לֹא חִלַּקְתָּה בָּהּ בֵּין בִּתָּהּ לְאֵם אִמָּהּ, אַף הוּא – לֹא תַּחְלוֹק בּוֹ בֵּין בִּתּוֹ לְאֵם אִמּוֹ.
human_translation: And furthermore, his like her just as her you did not distinguish between her daughter and the mother of her mother, so too his you should not distinguish between his daughter and the mother of his mother
llm_translation: And furthermore, it is like she said: What is it - you did not divide in it between her daughter and her mother's mother, so too, do not divide in it between his daughter and his mother's mother.

hebrew_text: וּלְמַאן דְּאָמַר סְקִילָה חֲמוּרָה, מֵהַאי קוּשְׁיָא לָא נְידוּנַהּ.
human_translation: And according to the one who says stoning is severe due to this difficulty, is not derived,
llm_translation: And for the one who says stoning is severe, from this question it is not resolved.

hebrew_text: אִי: מָה הוּא – כַּלָּתוֹ אֲסוּרָה, אַף הִיא – כַּלָּתָהּ אֲסוּרָה?
human_translation: If just as his his daughter-in-law is forbidden so too her her daughter-in-law is prohibited
llm_translation: If: what is - his daughter-in-law forbidden, also she - his daughter forbidden?

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי, אָמַר קְרָא: ״אֵשֶׁת בִּנְךָ הִיא״. מִשּׁוּם אֵשֶׁת בִּנְךָ אַתָּה מְחַיְּיבוֹ, וְאִי אַתָּה מְחַיְּיבוֹ מִשּׁוּם אֵשֶׁת בְּנָהּ.
human_translation: Abaye says: the verse states: she is your son’s wife, Due to the wife of his son you deem him liable but you do not deem him liable due to the wife of the son of
llm_translation: Abaye said, the verse says: "She is your son's wife." Because she is your son's wife, you are obligated to support her. And if you do not support her, it is because she is the wife of your son.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: בֵּין לְמַאן דְּאָמַר ״דּוּן מִינַּהּ וּמִינַּהּ״, בֵּין לְמַאן דְּאָמַר ״דּוּן מִינַּהּ וְאוֹקֵי בְאַתְרַהּ״ – לָא אָתְיָא.
human_translation: Rava says: both according to the one who says: Infer from it and from it, and according to the one who says: Infer from it but interpret to its place, is not derived
llm_translation: Rava said: Whether one says "judge each one separately" or one says "judge each one and then decide," it does not come.

hebrew_text: לְמַאן דְּאָמַר: דּוּן מִינַּהּ וּמִינַּהּ, מָה הוּא – כַּלָּתוֹ אֲסוּרָה, אַף הִיא נָמֵי – כַּלָּתָהּ אֲסוּרָה. וּמִינַּהּ: מָה הוּא בִּסְקִילָה, אַף הִיא נָמֵי בִּסְקִילָה.
human_translation: According to the one who says: Infer from it and from it, Just as his his daughter-in-law is forbidden so too her her daughter-in-law is forbidden And from it: Just as his by stoning so too her also by stoning
llm_translation: To whom says: judge from it and from it, what is it - his daughter-in-law is forbidden, so too she is indeed - his daughter-in-law is forbidden. And from it: what is it by stoning, so too she is indeed by stoning.

hebrew_text: לְמַאן דְּאָמַר: סְקִילָה חֲמוּרָה, אִיכָּא לְמִיפְרַךְ: מָה לְהוּא – שֶׁכֵּן אִמּוֹ בִּסְקִילָה, תֹּאמַר בְּהִיא – שֶׁאִמָּהּ בִּשְׂרֵפָה?
human_translation: According to the one who says: stoning is severe can be refuted: What about his in that his mother by stoning. Will you say with regard to her where her mother by burning?
llm_translation: To whom says: stoning severe, there is to refute: what to him - that his mother in stoning, you will say in burning - that his mother in burning?

hebrew_text: וְעוֹד: בִּתָּהּ בִּשְׂרֵפָה וְכַלָּתָהּ בִּסְקִילָה? הוּא בְּעַצְמוֹ יוֹכִיחַ, דְּבִתּוֹ בִּשְׂרֵפָה וְכַלָּתוֹ בִּסְקִילָה.
human_translation: And furthermore, the daughter of by burning, the daughter-in-law of by stoning? He himself, will prove as his daughter by burning, and his daughter-in-law by stoning.
llm_translation: And furthermore: her daughter was burned and her daughter-in-law was stoned? He himself will prove it, for his daughter was burned and his daughter-in-law was stoned.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: מָה הוּא – לֹא חִלַּקְתָּ בּוֹ בֵּין אִמּוֹ לְכַלָּתוֹ, אַף הִיא – לֹא תַּחְלוֹק בָּהּ בֵּין אִמָּהּ לְכַלָּתָהּ. וּלְמַאן דְּאָמַר שְׂרֵפָה חֲמוּרָה, מֵהַאי קוּשְׁיָא לָא נְידוּנֵין.
human_translation: Rather, just as his you did not distinguish between his mother and his daughter-in-law, so too her you should not distinguish between her mother and her daughter-in-law. And according to the one who says burning is severe due to this difficulty, is not derived.
llm_translation: Rather: What is it? - You did not differentiate between his mother and his daughter-in-law, so too she - should not differentiate between her mother and her daughter-in-law. And according to the one who says that a severe burning is more stringent, from this question they are not exempt.

hebrew_text: וּלְמַאן דְּאָמַר: דּוּן מִינַּהּ וְאוֹקֵי בְאַתְרַהּ, מָה הוּא – כַּלָּתוֹ אֲסוּרָה, אַף הִיא – כַּלָּתָהּ אֲסוּרָה. וְאוֹקֵי בְּאַתְרַהּ: הָתָם הוּא דְּבִסְקִילָה, אֲבָל הָכָא – בִּשְׂרֵפָה, כִּדְאַשְׁכְּחַן בְּאִמָּהּ.
human_translation: And according to the one who says: Infer from it but interpret to its place, Just as his his daughter-in-law is forbidden so too her her daughter-in-law is forbidden And interpret to its place: It is there, that by stoning; but here, her daughter-in-law by burning, as we found with regard to her mother.
llm_translation: And for the one who says: judge her and burn her together with her, what is it - her daughter-in-law is forbidden, so too she - her daughter-in-law is forbidden. And burn her together with her: there, it is by stoning, but here - by burning, as it is found in her mother.

hebrew_text: לְמַאן דְּאָמַר סְקִילָה חֲמוּרָה, אִיכָּא לְמִיפְרַךְ: מָה לְהוּא – שֶׁכֵּן אִמּוֹ בִּסְקִילָה, תֹּאמַר בְּהִיא – שֶׁאִמָּהּ בִּשְׂרֵפָה?
human_translation: According to the one who says: stoning is severe can be refuted: What about his in that his mother by stoning. Will you say with regard to her where her mother by burning?
llm_translation: To one who says stoning is severe, there is to refute: Just as his mother was stoned, you would say about her - that her mother was burned?

hebrew_text: וְעוֹד: מָה הוּא – חִלַּקְתָּ בּוֹ בֵּין בִּתּוֹ לְכַלָּתוֹ? אַף הִיא – תַּחְלוֹק בָּהּ בֵּין בִּתָּהּ לְכַלָּתָהּ. וּלְמַאן דְּאָמַר נָמֵי שְׂרֵפָה חֲמוּרָה, מֵהַאי קוּשְׁיָא לָא נְידוּנֵין.
human_translation: And furthermore, just as his you distinguished between his daughter and his daughter-in-law, so too her distinguish between her daughter and her daughter-in-law. And according to the one who says burning is severe due to this difficulty, is not derived.
llm_translation: And furthermore: What is it - you have divided between his daughter and his daughter-in-law? Also she - will divide in it between her daughter and her daughter-in-law. And according to the one who says a severe burning, from this question they are not resolved.

hebrew_text: בִּתּוֹ מֵאֲנוּסָתוֹ מִנַּיִן? הָאָמַר אַבָּיֵי: קַל וָחוֹמֶר, עַל בַּת בִּתּוֹ עָנוּשׁ – עַל בִּתּוֹ לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן?
human_translation: one’s daughter from a woman whom he raped, from where Doesn’t Abaye say a fortiori : is punished for the daughter of his daughter, for his daughter not all the more so
llm_translation: Daughter-in-law refusing her father-in-law, from where is it derived? Abaye said: a fortiori, regarding his granddaughter there is punishment - regarding his daughter, all the more so should there be punishment.

hebrew_text: וְכִי עוֹנְשִׁין מִן הַדִּין? גַּלּוֹיֵי מִילְּתָא בְעָלְמָא הוּא.
human_translation: But does administer punishment on inference is a mere disclosure the matter,
llm_translation: "And are punishments from the law? It is a revealed matter in the world."

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר, אָמַר לִי רַבִּי יִצְחָק בַּר אַבְדִּימִי: אָתְיָא ״הֵנָּה״ ״הֵנָּה״, אָתְיָא ״זִמָּה״ ״זִמָּה״.
human_translation: Rava says: Rabbi Yitzḥak bar Avdimi said to me is derived “ henna ,” “ henna ” derived “lewdness” “lewdness”
llm_translation: Rava said, Rabbi Yitzchak bar Avdimi said to me: It is written "henna" "henna," it is written "zimah" "zimah."

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי אֲבוּהּ דְּרַבִּי אָבִין: לְפִי שֶׁלֹּא לָמַדְנוּ לְבִתּוֹ מֵאֲנוּסָתוֹ, הוּצְרַךְ הַכָּתוּב לוֹמַר ״וּבַת אִישׁ כֹּהֵן״.
human_translation: The father of Rabbi Avin teaches: Due to that we did not learn his daughter from a woman whom he raped it was necessary for the verse to state: “And the daughter of any priest
llm_translation: It was taught in the school of Rabbi Avin: Because we did not teach his daughter to refuse her husband, the Scripture found it necessary to say, "And the daughter of a Kohen."

hebrew_text: אִי: מָה בַּת כֹּהֵן – הִיא בִּשְׂרֵפָה וְאֵין בּוֹעֲלָהּ בִּשְׂרֵפָה, אַף בִּתּוֹ מֵאֲנוּסָתוֹ – הִיא בִּשְׂרֵפָה וְאֵין בּוֹעֲלָהּ בִּשְׂרֵפָה?
human_translation: If just as the daughter of a priest she is by burning but her paramour is not by burning, so too his daughter from a woman whom he raped, she is by burning but her paramour, is not by burning?
llm_translation: Daughter of a Kohen - she is burned and one does not have relations with her through burning, so too his daughter if she was violated - she is burned and one does not have relations with her through burning?

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: אָמַר קְרָא ״אֶת אָבִיהָ הִיא מְחַלֶּלֶת״, מִי שֶׁמְּחַלֶּלֶת אֶת אָבִיהָ – יָצְתָה זוֹ שֶׁאָבִיהָ מְחַלְּלָהּ.
human_translation: Abaye says the verse states: “It is her father whom she is profaning,” one who profanes her father excluded this where her father profanes her.
llm_translation: Abaye said: The verse says, "She defiles her father," whoever defiles her father - this refers to a daughter whose father defiles her.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: בִּשְׁלָמָא הָתָם, אַפֵּיקְתֵּיהּ מִדִּינָא דְּבַת כֹּהֵן וְאוֹקֵימְתֵּהּ אַדִּינָא דְּבַת יִשְׂרָאֵל. הָכָא, אַדִּינָא דְּמַאן מוֹקְמַתְּ לֵיהּ? אַדִּינָא דִּפְנוּיָיה מוֹקְמַתְּ לֵיהּ?
human_translation: Rava says: Granted, there, you excluded from the punishment of daughter of a priest, and you established his with the punishment of Israelite woman, here, with whose punishment do you establish you establish his punishment with the punishment of an unmarried woman
llm_translation: Rava said: In truth, there, her dowry is taken from the estate of the daughter of a Kohen and established in the estate of the daughter of an Israelite. Here, from whose estate is it established? From the estate of the one who is designated for her.

hebrew_text: אַזְהָרָה לְבִתּוֹ מֵאֲנוּסָתוֹ מִנַּיִין? בִּשְׁלָמָא לְאַבָּיֵי וְרָבָא, מֵהֵיכָא דְּנָפְקָא לְהוּ עוֹנֶשׁ, מֵהָתָם נָפְקָא לְהוּ אַזְהָרָה.
human_translation: From where prohibition against his daughter from a woman whom he raped Granted, to Abaye and Rava, from which they derive punishment, from there they derive prohibition
llm_translation: Warning to his daughter from her rapist, from where? In accordance with Abbaye and Rava, from where did the punishment come out for them, from there came the warning to them.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לִדְתָנֵי אֲבוּהּ דְּרַבִּי אָבִין, מַאי? אָמַר רַבִּי אִילְעָא: אָמַר קְרָא, ״אַל תְּחַלֵּל אֶת בִּתְּךָ לְהַזְנוֹתָהּ״.
human_translation: But according to which Rabbi Avin’s father teaches, what Rabbi Ile’a says the verse states: “Do not profane your daughter by causing her to act licentiously [ lehaznotah ],
llm_translation: Rather, it should be taught in the version of the father of Rabbi Avin, what is it? Rabbi Ile'a said: The verse states, "Do not profane your daughter by making her a harlot."

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב אֲחוּהּ דְּרַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב: הַאי ״אַל תְּחַלֵּל אֶת בִּתְּךָ לְהַזְנוֹתָהּ״ לְהָכִי הוּא דַּאֲתָא? הַאי מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְכִדְתַנְיָא: ״אַל תְּחַלֵּל אֶת בִּתְּךָ לְהַזְנוֹתָהּ״ – יָכוֹל בְּכֹהֵן הַמַּשִּׂיא אֶת בִּתּוֹ לְלֵוִי וְיִשְׂרָאֵל הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״לְהַזְנוֹתָהּ״ – בְּחִילּוּל שֶׁבִּזְנוּת הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר, בְּמוֹסֵר אֶת בִּתּוֹ שֶׁלֹּא לְשֵׁם אִישׁוּת.
human_translation: Rabbi Ya’akov, brother of Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov, objects to this: this “Do not profane your daughter by causing her to act licentiously,” come to that This is necessary to that which is taught “Do not profane your daughter by causing her to act licentiously,” might with regard to a priest who marries his daughter to a Levite or Israelite the verse is speaking, the verse states “by causing her to act licentiously,” with regard to profaning that involves licentiousness the verse is speaking. to one who gives his daughter not for the sake of marriage.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: Rabbi Yaakov, the brother of Rav Acha bar Yaakov, raised an objection: Is this verse "Do not profane your daughter to make her a harlot" coming for this purpose? This one wants to learn it according to the teaching: "Do not profane your daughter to make her a harlot" – can a Kohen who marries off his daughter to a Levi or an Israelite be included in the verse that the Scripture speaks of? The verse teaches: "to make her a harlot" – the Scripture speaks of a profanation in harlotry, but in giving his daughter in marriage not for the sake of marriage.

hebrew_text: אִם כֵּן, לֵימָא קְרָא ״אַל תַּחֵל״! מַאי ״אַל תְּחַלֵּל״? שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ תַּרְתֵּי. וְאַבָּיֵי וְרָבָא, הַאי ״אַל תְּחַלֵּל אֶת בִּתְּךָ לְהַזְנוֹתָהּ״ מַאי עָבְדִי לֵיהּ? אָמַר רַבִּי מָנִי: זֶה הַמַּשִּׂיא אֶת בִּתּוֹ לְזָקֵן.
human_translation: If so, let the verse say: Do not profane [ taḥel ]. What Do not profane teḥalel] ? Conclude two from it. And Abaye and Rava, what do they do with this “Do not profane your daughter by causing her to act licentiously”? Rabbi Mani says: This one who marries his daughter to an old man.
llm_translation: If so, let us say the verse "Do not begin"! What is "Do not profane"? Learn from it two things. And Abbaye and Rava, this "Do not profane your daughter by making her a harlot," what can be done for it? Rabbi Mani said: This is one who betroths his daughter to an old man.

hebrew_text: כִּדְתַנְיָא: ״אַל תְּחַלֵּל אֶת בִּתְּךָ לְהַזְנוֹתָהּ״. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: זֶה הַמַּשִּׂיא אֶת בִּתּוֹ לְזָקֵן. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: זֶה הַמַּשְׁהֶא בִּתּוֹ בּוֹגֶרֶת.
human_translation: as it is taught “Do not profane your daughter by causing her to act licentiously.” Rabbi Eliezer says: This is one who marries his daughter to an old man. Rabbi Akiva says: This is one who delays his daughter a grown woman.
llm_translation: As it was taught: "Do not profane your daughter by making her a harlot." Rabbi Eliezer says: This refers to one who betroths his daughter to an old man. Rabbi Akiva says: This refers to one who causes his daughter to engage in intercourse.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: אֵין לְךָ עָנִי בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל אֶלָּא רָשָׁע עָרוּם, וְהַמַּשְׁהֶא בִּתּוֹ בּוֹגֶרֶת. אַטּוּ הַמַּשְׁהֶא בִּתּוֹ בּוֹגֶרֶת לָאו רָשָׁע עָרוּם הוּא?
human_translation: Rav Kahana says in the name of Rabbi Akiva: You do not have a pauper among Jewish people other a conniving wicked person, and one who delays his daughter a grown woman. Is that to say one who delays his daughter a grown woman is not a conniving, wicked person?
llm_translation: Rav Kahana said in the name of Rabbi Akiva: "You have no poor person in Israel except for a cunning wicked one, and one who marries his daughter to a Torah scholar." But is one who marries his daughter to a Torah scholar not a cunning wicked one?

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי:
human_translation: Abaye says:
llm_translation: Said Abaye:

hebrew_text: הָכִי קָאָמַר: אֵיזֶהוּ עָנִי רָשָׁע עָרוּם? זֶה הַמַּשְׁהֶא בִּתּוֹ בּוֹגֶרֶת. וְאָמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: הֱוֵי זָהִיר מִן הַיּוֹעֶצְךָ לְפִי דַּרְכּוֹ.
human_translation: This is saying: Who is a pauper a conniving, wicked person? This is one who delays his daughter a grown woman. And Rav Kahana says in the name of Rabbi Akiva: Beware of one who advises you according to his interests,
llm_translation: So it is stated: Who is a poor, wicked, cunning person? This is one who marries his daughter to a Torah scholar. And Rav Kahana said in the name of Rabbi Akiva: Be cautious in your advice, according to his way.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: הַמַּשִּׂיא אֶת בִּתּוֹ לְזָקֵן, וְהַמַּשִּׂיא אִשָּׁה לִבְנוֹ קָטָן, וְהַמַּחְזִיר אֲבֵידָה לְנׇכְרִי – עָלָיו הַכָּתוּב אוֹמֵר: ״לְמַעַן סְפוֹת הָרָוָה אֶת הַצְּמֵאָה. לֹא יֹאבֶה ה׳ סְלֹחַ לוֹ״.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Rav says: One who marries his daughter to an old man, and one who takes a wife for his minor son, and one who returns a lost item to a gentile With regard to the verse states: that the quenched shall be added to the thirsty. The Lord will not be willing to pardon him”
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: One who marries off his daughter to an elderly man, and one who marries a woman to his young son, and one who returns a lost object to a non-Jew - the Scripture states regarding him: "So that they may drink, the weary and the thirsty may eat. The Lord will not forgive him."

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: הָאוֹהֵב אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ כְּגוּפוֹ, וְהַמְכַבְּדָהּ יוֹתֵר מִגּוּפוֹ, וְהַמַּדְרִיךְ בָּנָיו וּבְנוֹתָיו בְּדֶרֶךְ יְשָׁרָה, וְהַמַּשִּׂיאָן סָמוּךְ לְפִירְקָן – עָלָיו הַכָּתוּב אוֹמֵר: ״וְיָדַעְתָּ כִּי שָׁלוֹם אׇהֳלֶךָ וּפָקַדְתָּ נָוְךָ וְלֹא תֶחֱטָא״. סָמוּךְ לְפִירְקָן – שָׁאנֵי.
human_translation: raises an objection who loves his wife as himself, and who esteems her more than himself, and who instructs his sons and daughters to an upright path, and who marries them adjacent to their puberty, Concerning him the verse states: “And you shall know that your tent is in peace; and you shall visit your habitation and shall miss nothing” Adjacent to their puberty is different
