llm_translation: The opponent raises an objection: One who loves his wife as his own body, and honors her more than his own body, and guides his sons and daughters in the path of righteousness, and marries them off when they reach maturity - upon him the Scripture says: "And you shall know that your tent is at peace, and you shall visit your fold and not sin." Marrying them off when they reach maturity - this is different.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הָאוֹהֵב אֶת שְׁכֵינָיו, וְהַמְקָרֵב אֶת קְרוֹבָיו, וְהַנּוֹשֵׂא אֶת בַּת אֲחוֹתוֹ, וְהַמַּלְוֶה סֶלַע לְעָנִי בִּשְׁעַת דּוֹחְקוֹ – עָלָיו הַכָּתוּב אוֹמֵר: ״אָז תִּקְרָא וַה׳ יַעֲנֶה״.
human_translation: The Sages taught: One who loves his neighbors, and one who brings his relatives close, and one who marries the daughter of his sister, and one who lends a sela to a poor man at his time of need, with regard to the verse states: then shall you call, and the Lord will answer;
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: One who loves his neighbors, and brings near his relatives, and marries off his sister's daughter, and lends money to a poor person in his time of distress - concerning him the verse says: "Then you shall call, and the Lord will answer."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״אֹתוֹ וְאֶתְהֶן״ – אוֹתוֹ וְאֶת אַחַת מֵהֶן, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: אוֹתוֹ וְאֶת שְׁתֵּיהֶן.
human_translation: The Sages taught “both him and them”? him and one of them, the statement of Rabbi Yishmael. Rabbi Akiva says: him and the two of them.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: "him and them" - him and one of them, the words of Rabbi Yishmael. Rabbi Akiva says: him and both of them.

hebrew_text: מַאי בֵּינַיְיהוּ? אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: מַשְׁמָעוּת דּוֹרְשִׁים אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: What between them? Abaye says: between is the interpretation of the meaning
llm_translation: What is the difference between them? Abaye said: There is a difference in the interpretation of the tradition.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל סָבַר: ״אֹתוֹ וְאֶתְהֶן״ – אוֹתוֹ וְאֶת אַחַת מֵהֶן, שֶׁכֵּן בְּלָשׁוֹן יְוָנִי קוֹרִין לְאַחַת ״הִינָא״. וְאֵם חֲמוֹתוֹ – מִדְּרָשָׁא אָתְיָא. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא סָבַר: ״אֹתוֹ וְאֶתְהֶן״ – אוֹתוֹ וְאֶת שְׁתֵּיהֶן, וְאֵם חֲמוֹתוֹ הָכָא כְּתִיבָא.
human_translation: Rabbi Yishmael holds “both him and them [ et’hen ]” him and one of them, as in the Greek language one calls one heina . And the mother of his mother-in-law is derived through an interpretation Rabbi Akiva holds “both him and them” him and both of them; and the mother of his mother-in-law written here
llm_translation: Rabbi Yishmael holds: "him and them" - him and one of them, as in the Greek language they read one as "hina." And if his mother-in-law - it is derived from a teaching. Rabbi Akiva holds: "him and them" - him and both of them, and if his mother-in-law here it is written.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: חֲמוֹתוֹ לְאַחַר מִיתָה אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ. רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל סָבַר: חֲמוֹתוֹ לְאַחַר מִיתָה בִּשְׂרֵפָה, וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא סָבַר: אִיסּוּרָא בְּעָלְמָא.
human_translation: Rava says: between them his mother-in-law after death Rabbi Yishmael holds his mother-in-law after death by burning. And Rabbi Akiva maintains a mere prohibition
llm_translation: Rava said: His mother-in-law after his death there is between them. Rabbi Yishmael holds: His mother-in-law after his death by burning, and Rabbi Akiva holds: It is merely a prohibition.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ וְאֵלּוּ הַנֶּהֱרָגִין: הָרוֹצֵחַ, וְאַנְשֵׁי עִיר הַנִּדַּחַת.
human_translation: And these are who are killed The murderer; and the residents of an idolatrous city,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: And these are the ones who are executed by the court: the murderer, and the people of a condemned city.

hebrew_text: רוֹצֵחַ שֶׁהִכָּה אֵת רֵעֵהוּ בְּאֶבֶן אוֹ בְּבַרְזֶל, וְכָבַשׁ עָלָיו לְתוֹךְ הַמַּיִם אוֹ לְתוֹךְ הָאוּר, וְאֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לַעֲלוֹת מִשָּׁם וָמֵת – חַיָּיב.
human_translation: a murderer who struck another with a stone or with iron, or held him in the water or in the fire, and could not extricate himself from there and he died,  liable
llm_translation: A murderer who struck his fellow with a stone or with iron, and he drowned him in water or in a pit, and he cannot ascend from there and he dies - he is liable.

hebrew_text: דְּחָפוֹ לְתוֹךְ הַמַּיִם אוֹ לְתוֹךְ הָאוּר, וְיָכוֹל לַעֲלוֹת מִשָּׁם וָמֵת – פָּטוּר. שִׁיסָּה בּוֹ אֶת הַכֶּלֶב, שִׁיסָּה בּוֹ אֶת הַנָּחָשׁ – פָּטוּר. הִשִּׁיךְ בּוֹ אֶת הַנָּחָשׁ: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה מְחַיֵּיב, וַחֲכָמִים פּוֹטְרִין.
human_translation: one pushed into the water or into the fire and could have extricated himself from there and he died, exempt one set a dog against one set a snake against exempt caused the snake to bite him Rabbi Yehuda deems liable and the Rabbis exempt
llm_translation: They pushed him into the water or into the fire, and he can come out from there and die - he is exempt. If he threw him to the dog, if he threw him to the snake - he is exempt. If he threw him to the snake: Rabbi Yehuda obligates, and the sages exempt.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: מִפְּנֵי מָה לֹא נֶאֶמְרָה ״יָד״ בַּבַּרְזֶל? שֶׁהַבַּרְזֶל מֵמִית בְּכׇל שֶׁהוּא.
human_translation: Shmuel says: For what hand” not stated with regard to the iron that an iron of any size kills.
llm_translation: Gemara, Shmuel said: Why is the term "hand" not mentioned in connection with iron? Because iron causes death in every way.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: רַבִּי אוֹמֵר, גָּלוּי וְיָדוּעַ לִפְנֵי מִי שֶׁאָמַר וְהָיָה הָעוֹלָם שֶׁהַבַּרְזֶל מֵמִית בְּכׇל שֶׁהוּא, לְפִיכָךְ לֹא נָתְנָה תּוֹרָה בּוֹ שִׁיעוּר. וְהָנֵי מִילֵּי דְּבַרְזֵיהּ מִיבְרָז.
human_translation: This is also taught Rabbi says: It is revealed and known before He Who spoke and the world came into being that an iron of any size kills. Therefore, the Torah did not provide a measure for it. And this statement when stabbed him
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi says, it is revealed and known before the One who spoke and the world came into being, that iron kills in every way. Therefore, the Torah did not give it a specific measurement. And the words of his father-in-law are more effective.

hebrew_text: וְכָבַשׁ עָלָיו לְתוֹךְ הַמַּיִם. רֵישָׁא רְבוּתָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן, וְסֵיפָא רְבוּתָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן. רֵישָׁא רְבוּתָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן: אַף עַל גַּב דְּלָאו אִיהוּ דְּחָפוֹ, כֵּיוָן דְּאֵין יָכוֹל לַעֲלוֹת מִשָּׁם וָמֵת – חַיָּיב. סֵיפָא רְבוּתָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן: אַף עַל גַּב דִּדְחָפוֹ, כֵּיוָן דְּיָכוֹל לַעֲלוֹת מִשָּׁם וָמֵת – פָּטוּר.
human_translation: Or held him in the water died, The first clause teaches us a novel and the latter clause teaches us a novel The first clause teaches us a novel Even though it was not he who pushed since could not extricate himself from there and he died, liable The latter clause teaches us a novel Even though he pushed since could have extricated himself from there and he died, exempt
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And he shall push it into the water. The beginning, it is abundantly clear to us, and the end, it is abundantly clear to us. The beginning, it is abundantly clear to us: even though he did not push it, since it cannot ascend from there and it dies - he is liable. The end, it is abundantly clear to us: even though he pushed it, since it can ascend from there and it dies - he is exempt." English translation:

hebrew_text: כָּבַשׁ – מְנָלַן? אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: דְּאָמַר קְרָא ״אוֹ בְאֵיבָה״, לְרַבּוֹת אֶת הַמְצַמְצֵם.
human_translation: From where do we held Shmuel says: as the verse states: “Or in enmity to include one who confines
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Kavash - menalan?" Amar Shmuel: "D'amar kra 'o ve'ivah', l'ravot et hametzamtzem." English translation: "Kavash - where is it derived from?" Shmuel said: "As the verse states 'or in enmity,' to include one who diminishes."

hebrew_text: הָהוּא גַּבְרָא דְּצַמְצְמַהּ לְחֵיוְתָא דְּחַבְרֵיהּ בְּשִׁימְשָׁא, וּמִתָה. רָבִינָא מְחַיֵּיב, רַב אַחָא בַּר רַב פָּטַר.
human_translation: a certain man who confined the animal of another in the sun and it died Ravina deemed liable Rav Aḥa bar Rav deemed
llm_translation: That man who squeezed the animal of his friend in the sun, and it died. Ravina obligates, Rav Acha bar Rav exempts.

hebrew_text: רָבִינָא מְחַיֵּיב, קַל וָחוֹמֶר: וּמָה רוֹצֵחַ שֶׁלֹּא עָשָׂה בּוֹ שׁוֹגֵג כְּמֵזִיד וְאוֹנֶס כְּרָצוֹן, חִיֵּיב בּוֹ אֶת הַמְצַמְצֵם.
human_translation: Ravina deemed liable an a fortiori Just as a murderer, where did not render unwittingly, like intentionally, and due to circumstances beyond his control, like with intent, rendered one who confines liable
llm_translation: Ravinah obligates, light and heavy: And what about a murderer who did not commit the act unintentionally as if intentional, and by coercion as if willingly, he is liable for the one who diminishes.

hebrew_text: נְזָקִין, שֶׁעָשָׂה בָּהֶן שׁוֹגֵג כְּמֵזִיד וְאוֹנֶס כְּרָצוֹן – אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁחִיֵּיב בָּהֶן אֶת הַמְצַמְצֵם?
human_translation: damage, where rendered unwittingly like intentionally, and due to circumstances beyond his control like with intent, is it not logical that rendered one who confines liable
llm_translation: Damages, that one caused with them unintentionally as intentionally and forcibly as willingly - is it not the law that he is liable for the one who restricts?

hebrew_text: רַב אַחָא בַּר רַב פּוֹטֵר. אָמַר רַב מְשַׁרְשְׁיָא: מַאי טַעְמָא דַּאֲבוּהּ דְּאַבָּא דְּפוֹטֵר? אָמַר קְרָא: ״מוֹת יוּמַת הַמַּכֶּה רֹצֵחַ הוּא״. בְּרוֹצֵחַ הוּא דְּחַיֵּיב לַן מְצַמְצֵם, בִּנְזָקִין לָא חַיֵּיב לַן מְצַמְצֵם.
human_translation: Rav Aḥa bar Rav, exempts Rav Mesharshiyya said: What is the reason of the father of father, who exempts the verse states: the assailant shall be put to death; he is a murderer” is in a murderer that renders for us one who confines liable in damage does not render for us one who confines liable
llm_translation: Rav Aḥa bar Rav Poter. Amar Rav Mesharshya: Maai taama de'avuh de'aba de'poter? Amar kra: "Mot yumat hamakeh rotzeah hu." Berotzeah hu dechayyav lan metzamtzem, binzakin la chayyav lan metzamtzem.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: כְּפָתוֹ וּמֵת בָּרָעָב – פָּטוּר. וְאָמַר רָבָא: כְּפָתוֹ בַּחַמָּה וָמֵת, בְּצִינָּה וָמֵת – חַיָּיב. סוֹף חַמָּה לָבֹא, סוֹף צִינָּה לָבֹא – פָּטוּר.
human_translation: Rava says: one bound and he died of starvation, exempt And Rava says: bound in the sun and he died in a cold and he died liable ultimately sun would arrive ultimately cold would reach exempt
llm_translation: Rava said: If one's hand is cut off and he dies of starvation - he is exempt. And Rava said: If one's hand is cut off in the heat and he dies, in the cold and he dies - he is liable. If the end of heat is to come, if the end of cold is to come - he is exempt.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רָבָא: כְּפָתוֹ לִפְנֵי אֲרִי – פָּטוּר, לִפְנֵי יַתּוּשִׁין – חַיָּיב. רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ לִפְנֵי יַתּוּשִׁין נָמֵי פָּטוּר, הָנֵי אָזְלִי וְהָנֵי אָתוּ.
human_translation: And Rava says: If one bound before a lion, exempt before mosquitoes liable Rav Ashi says: Even before mosquitoes exempt those went and these came.
llm_translation: And Rava said: If one's bread is before a lion - he is exempt, before foxes - he is liable. Rav Ashi said: Even before foxes he is also exempt, those go and those come.

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר: כָּפָה עָלָיו גִּיגִית, וּפָרַע עָלָיו מַעֲזִיבָה – רָבָא וְרַבִּי זֵירָא, חַד אָמַר: חַיָּיב, וְחַד אָמַר: פָּטוּר.
human_translation: It was stated overturned a vat upon or breached plaster Rava and Rabbi Zeira One says liable and one says exempt
llm_translation: It was stated: A roof collapsed on him, and a beam fell on him - Rava and Rabbi Zeira, one said: liable, and one said: exempt.

hebrew_text: תִּסְתַּיַּים דְּרָבָא הוּא דְּאָמַר פָּטוּר, דְּאָמַר רָבָא: כְּפָתוֹ וּמֵת בָּרָעָב – פָּטוּר.
human_translation: Conclude that Rava is who says exempt as Rava says: bound and he died of starvation, exempt
llm_translation: The completion of Rava, he said exempt, as Rava said: "Like his bread and he dies of hunger" - exempt.

hebrew_text: אַדְּרַבָּה, תִּסְתַּיֵּים דְּרַבִּי זֵירָא הוּא דְּאָמַר פָּטוּר, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: הַאי מַאן דְּעַיְּילֵיהּ לְחַבְרֵיהּ בְּבֵיתָא דְשֵׁישָׁא וְאַדְלֵיק לֵיהּ שְׁרָגָא וָמֵת – חַיָּיב. טַעְמָא דְּאַדְלֵיק לֵיהּ שְׁרָגָא, הָא לָא אַדְלֵיק לֵיהּ שְׁרָגָא – לָא.
human_translation: On the contrary, conclude that it is Rabbi Zeira who says exempt, as Rabbi Zeira says: this who took another into house of marble and he kindled a lamp [ sheraga ] for him, and he died liable the reason because he kindled a lamp for him, but if he did not kindle a lamp for him, no,
llm_translation: The Gemara concludes: It is Rabbi Zeira who said that one is exempt, as Rabbi Zeira said: One who brings his friend into a house of marble and lights a candle for him, and he dies – he is liable. The reason that if he lights a candle for him, he is liable, is that if he does not light a candle for him – he is not liable.

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי: הָתָם, בְּלָא שְׁרָגָא, לָא מַתְחֵיל הַבְלָא
human_translation: say: there, without lamp, the atmosphere does not begin
llm_translation: They said: There, without a candle, one does not begin the blessing.

hebrew_text: בְּשַׁעְתֵּיהּ. הָכָא, בְּלָא שְׁרָגָא נָמֵי מַתְחֵיל הַבְלָא בְּשַׁעְתֵּיהּ.
human_translation: at the time of Here, even without lamp the atmosphere begins at the time of
llm_translation: At that time. Here, without a lamp, he begins without a lamp at that time.

hebrew_text: (סִימָן: סוּלָּם, תְּרִיס, סַמָּנִין, בַּכּוֹתֶל).
human_translation: a mnemonic Ladder, shield, herbs, in a wall.
llm_translation: Section: Ladder, lattice, markers, in the wall.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: דְּחָפוֹ לְבוֹר, וְסוּלָּם בַּבּוֹר, וּבָא אַחֵר וְסִילְּקוֹ, וַאֲפִילּוּ הוּא קָדַם וְסִילְּקוֹ – פָּטוּר, דִּבְעִידָּנָא דְּשַׁדְיֵיהּ יָכוֹל לַעֲלוֹת הוּא.
human_translation: Rava says: one pushed into the pit and a ladder in the pit and another came and removed or even himself removed before exempt that at the time that he cast was able to ascend
llm_translation: Rava said: If one pushes another into a pit, and there is a ladder in the pit, and another person comes and removes it, even if the first person had already removed it - he is exempt, because at the time when he could ascend, he could ascend.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רָבָא: זָרַק חֵץ, וּתְרִיס בְּיָדוֹ, וּבָא אַחֵר וּנְטָלוֹ, וַאֲפִילּוּ הוּא קָדַם וּנְטָלוֹ – פָּטוּר, דִּבְעִידָּנָא דְּשַׁדְיֵיהּ בֵּיהּ מִיפְסָק פְּסִיקִי גִּירֵיהּ.
human_translation: And Rava says: shot an arrow and a shield [ teris ] in hand, another came and took or even took before exempt that at the time that he shot at his arrows were blocked
llm_translation: And Rava said: If one shoots an arrow, and it breaks in his hand, and another person comes and takes it, even if he had already taken it beforehand - he is exempt, because in the case where his hand caused it to break, his connection with it is severed.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רָבָא: זָרַק בּוֹ חֵץ, וְסַמָּנִין בְּיָדוֹ, וּבָא אַחֵר וּפִיזְּרָן, וַאֲפִילּוּ הוּא קָדַם וּפִיזְּרָן – פָּטוּר, דִּבְעִידָּנָא דִּשְׁדָא בֵּיהּ יָכוֹל לְהִתְרַפְּאוֹת הֲוָה.
human_translation: And Rava says: shot an arrow and herbs in his possession another came and scattered or even scattered them before exempt that at the time that he shot at him, was able to be cured.
llm_translation: And Rava said: If one shot an arrow into him, and he marked it in his hand, and another came and scattered it, and even if he had come first and scattered it - he is exempt, for in the time that the arrow was in it, he could have been healed.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: הִלְכָּךְ, אֲפִילּוּ סַמָּנִין בַּשּׁוּק. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרָבָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: נִזְדַּמְּנוּ לוֹ סַמָּנִין, מַהוּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הֲרֵי יָצָא מִבֵּית דִּין זַכַּאי.
human_translation: Rav Ashi says: therefore, even herbs in the marketplace, Rav Aḥa, son of Rava, said to Rav Ashi: herbs happened into what is said to He emerged from court innocent.
llm_translation: Rav Ashei said: Therefore, even if they are marked in the market. Rav Acha, son of Rava, said to Rav Ashei: If they found his marks, what is the law? He said to him: Behold, he has been acquitted by the court.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רָבָא: זָרַק צְרוֹר בַּכּוֹתֶל, וְחָזְרָה לַאֲחוֹרֶיהָ וְהָרְגָה – חַיָּיב. וְתַנָּא תּוּנָא: כְּגוֹן אֵלּוּ הַמְשַׂחֲקִין בְּכַדּוּר שֶׁהָרְגוּ, בְּמֵזִיד – נֶהֱרָגִין, בְּשׁוֹגֵג – גּוֹלִין.
human_translation: And Rava says: threw a stone off the wall and rebounded back and killed liable. And the tanna taught where those who were playing with a ball killed intentionally, they are executed unwittingly, they are exiled.
llm_translation: And Rava said: If one threw a stone at a wall, and it rebounded back and killed someone behind it - he is liable. And it was taught in a Baraita: For example, those who play with a ball and it kills, if done intentionally - they are put to death, if done accidentally - they are exiled.

hebrew_text: בְּשׁוֹגֵג גּוֹלִין, פְּשִׁיטָא! בְּמֵזִיד נֶהֱרָגִין אִיצְטְרִיךְ לֵיהּ. מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: הַתְרָאַת סָפֵק הִיא, מִי יֵימַר דְּהָדְרָה? קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: unwittingly, they are exiled; obvious? was necessary for intentionally, they are executed. lest you say forewarning is uncertain, who is to say that rebound teaches us
llm_translation: In error, we roll the stone; it is obvious! Intentionally, we are killed, it is necessary. What might you say: It is a warning of doubt, who can say that it will return? It is heard for us.

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי רַב תַּחְלִיפָא בַּר מַעְרְבָא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: כְּגוֹן אֵלּוּ הַמְשַׂחֲקִין בְּכַדּוּר שֶׁהָרְגוּ, תּוֹךְ אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת – פָּטוּר, חוּץ לְאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת – חַיָּיב.
human_translation: Rav Taḥlifa, from the West, taught before Rabbi Abbahu: where those who were playing with a ball killed within four cubits exempt beyond four cubits, liable
llm_translation: It was taught: Rav Tahalifa son of Ma'arva stood before Rabbi Avahu and said: For example, those who play with a ball and accidentally kill someone within four cubits are exempt, but beyond four cubits they are liable.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבִינָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִי דְּקָא נִיחָא לֵיהּ, אֲפִילּוּ פּוּרְתָּא נָמֵי. אִי דְּלָא נִיחָא לֵיהּ, אֲפִילּוּ טוּבָא נָמֵי לָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: סְתָם מְשַׂחֲקִין בְּכַדּוּר, כַּמָּה דְּעָיְילִי טְפֵי – מֵינָח נִיחָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi, What are the circumstances? If he was amenable even less if he was not amenable not even greater said to him: ordinary play with a ball, the farther they enter amenable they are
llm_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: How is the case? If it is pleasing to him, even a small amount is acceptable. If it is not pleasing to him, even a large amount is not acceptable. He said to him: People generally play with a ball, the more they throw it, the more it pleases them.

hebrew_text: לְמֵימְרָא דִּכְהַאי גַּוְונָא כֹּחוֹ הוּא? וּרְמִינְהוּ: הַמְקַדֵּשׁ, וְנָפַל קִידּוּשׁ עַל יָדוֹ אוֹ עַל הַצַּד, וְאַחַר כָּךְ נָפַל לְשׁוֹקֶת – פָּסוּל.
human_translation: to say that a case like this, is his force? And raises a contradiction one who sanctifies and the sacred fell on his hand or on the side and thereafter it fell into the trough, unfit,
llm_translation: In the matter of this case, is his intention effective? And they raised an objection: One who sanctifies, and the sanctification falls on his hand or on the side, and afterwards it falls to the ground - it is invalid.

hebrew_text: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן? בְּשׁוֹתֵת.
human_translation: With what are we dealing here? with trickle
llm_translation: Here we are dealing with what? With a "shoteh."

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: מַחַט שֶׁהָיָה נְתוּנָה עַל הַחֶרֶס, וְהִזָּה עָלֶיהָ – סָפֵק עַל הַמַּחַט הִזָּה, סָפֵק עַל הַחֶרֶס הִזָּה וּמִיצָּה עָלֶיהָ – הַזָּאָתוֹ פָּסוּל.
human_translation: Come hear a needle that was placed on an earthenware and one sprinkled uncertainty sprinkled on the needle sprinkled on the earthenware and sprayed upon his sprinkling is unfit.
llm_translation: Come and hear: a needle that was placed on a potsherd, and one sprinkled on it - if there is doubt whether he sprinkled on the needle or on the potsherd, and he squeezed it - this is invalid.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִינָּנָא בַּר יְהוּדָה מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב: ״מָצָא״ אִיתְּמַר.
human_translation: Rav Ḥinnana bar Yehuda said in the name of Rav: found [ matza ] was stated.
llm_translation: Rav Chinana bar Yehuda said in the name of Rav: "It was stated, 'He found.'"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: הַאי מַאן דְּכַפְתֵיהּ לְחַבְרֵיהּ, וְאַשְׁקֵיל עֲלֵיהּ בִּידְקָא דְמַיָּא – גִּירֵי דִידֵיהּ הוּא, וּמִיחַיַּיב. הָנֵי מִילֵּי בְּכֹחַ רִאשׁוֹן, אֲבָל בְּכֹחַ שֵׁנִי – גְּרָמָא בְּעָלְמָא הוּא.
human_translation: Rav Pappa says: this one who bound another and diverted a flow of water upon him and he died, is his arrows and he is liable. this matter by primary force, But by secondary force it is merely an indirect
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: One who covers it for his friend, and I will weigh it with the hand of water - it is his own grain, and he is liable. These words are in the power of the first, but in the power of the second - it is a mere cause.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: זָרַק צְרוֹר לְמַעְלָה וְהָלְכָה לִצְדָדִין וְהָרְגָה – חַיָּיב. אֲמַר לֵיהּ מָר בַּר רַב אָשֵׁי לְרַב פָּפָּא: מַאי טַעְמָא? מִשּׁוּם דְּכֹחוֹ הוּא? אִי כֹּחוֹ – תֵּיזִיל לְעֵיל,
human_translation: And Rav Pappa says: threw a stone upward and it went to the side, and killed liable. Mar, son of Rav Ashi, said to Rav Pappa: What is the reason due to that is force of his if force of his should go upward
llm_translation: And Rav Papa said: If one threw a bundle upwards and it went sideways and killed someone - he is liable. Mar bar Rav Ashi said to Rav Papa: What is the reason? Because it is his strength? If it is his strength - it should go upwards.

hebrew_text: וְאִי לָאו כֹּחוֹ הוּא – תֵּיזִיל לְתַחַת. אֶלָּא, כֹּחַ כָּחוּשׁ הוּא.
human_translation: And were it not the force of his would go down Rather, it is a weak force,
llm_translation: "If not, it is not his strength - it goes down below. Rather, it is a weak strength."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הִכּוּהוּ עֲשָׂרָה בְּנֵי אָדָם בַּעֲשָׂרָה מַקְלוֹת וָמֵת, בֵּין בְּבַת אַחַת, בֵּין בְּזֶה אַחַר זֶה – פְּטוּרִין. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בְּתִירָא אוֹמֵר: בְּזֶה אַחַר זֶה, הָאַחֲרוֹן חַיָּיב, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁקֵּירַב אֶת מִיתָתוֹ.
human_translation: The Sages taught: ten people struck with ten sticks and he died, whether simultaneously, whether one after the other, they are exempt Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira says: one after the other, the last liable, because he hastened his death.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: If ten people struck him with ten sticks and he died, whether all at once or one after the other - they are exempt. Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira says: If one after the other, the last one is liable, because he hastened his death.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: וּשְׁנֵיהֶם מִקְרָא אֶחָד דָּרְשׁוּ, ״וְאִישׁ כִּי יַכֶּה כׇּל נֶפֶשׁ אָדָם״. רַבָּנַן סָבְרִי: ״כָּל נֶפֶשׁ״ – עַד דְּאִיכָּא כׇּל נֶפֶשׁ, וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בְּתִירָא סָבַר: ״כׇּל נֶפֶשׁ״ – כׇּל דְּהוּא נֶפֶשׁ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: And both interpreted the same verse “And a man who strikes any soul mortally, The Rabbis hold “any soul” only when there is an entire soul, And Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira holds “any soul” any soul,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: And both of them expounded one verse, "And if a man strikes any human soul." The Rabbis hold: "Any soul" - until there is every soul. And Rabbi Yehuda ben Betera holds: "Any soul" - any particular soul.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: הַכֹּל מוֹדִים בְּהוֹרֵג אֶת הַטְּרֵיפָה שֶׁהוּא פָּטוּר, בְּגוֹסֵס בִּידֵי שָׁמַיִם שֶׁהוּא חַיָּיב. לֹא נֶחְלְקוּ אֶלָּא בְּגוֹסֵס בִּידֵי אָדָם. מָר מְדַמֵּי לֵיהּ לִטְרֵיפָה, וּמָר מְדַמֵּי לֵיהּ לְגוֹסֵס בִּידֵי שָׁמַיִם.
human_translation: Rava says: All concede in kills one who has a wound that will cause him to die within twelve months [ tereifa ] exempt in dying at the hand of Heaven that he is liable, They disagree only in dying at the hand of a person. Sage, likens to a tereifa , And Sage, likens to dying at the hand of Heaven,
llm_translation: Rava said: Everyone agrees that one who kills a treifah is exempt, but regarding one who causes death through an act of God, he is liable. They only disagreed regarding causing death through an act of man. One Master compares it to a treifah, and the other Master compares it to causing death through an act of God.

hebrew_text: מַאן דִּמְדַמֵּי לֵיהּ לִטְרֵיפָה, מַאי טַעְמָא לָא מְדַמֵּי לֵיהּ לְגוֹסֵס בִּידֵי שָׁמַיִם? גּוֹסֵס בִּידֵי שָׁמַיִם לָא אִיתְעֲבִיד בֵּיהּ מַעֲשֶׂה, הַאי אִיתְעֲבִיד בֵּיהּ מַעֲשֶׂה.
human_translation: the one who likens to a tereifa , what is the reason he does not liken it to dying at the hand of Heaven? dying at the hand of Heaven, no action was performed to him, this an action was performed to him.
llm_translation: One who compares it to a treifah, what is the reason that he does not compare it to a goses in the hands of Heaven? A goses in the hands of Heaven does not perform an action, whereas this one performs an action.

hebrew_text: וּמַאן דִּמְדַמֵּי לֵיהּ לְגוֹסֵס בִּידֵי שָׁמַיִם, מַאי טַעְמָא לָא מְדַמֵּי לֵיהּ לִטְרֵיפָה? טְרֵיפָה – מְחַתְּכִי סִימָנִים, הָא לָא מְחַתְּכִי סִימָנִים.
human_translation: And the one who likens to dying at the hand of Heaven, what is the reason he does not liken it to a tereifa ? a tereifa , organs, are cut, this not organs, are cut,
llm_translation: And one who compares it to a bird caught by the hands of Heaven, what is the reason that he does not compare it to a treifah? Treifah - it has severed signs, whereas this does not have severed signs.

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי תַּנָּא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב שֵׁשֶׁת: ״וְאִישׁ כִּי יַכֶּה כׇּל נֶפֶשׁ אָדָם״ – לְהָבִיא הַמַּכֶּה אֶת חֲבֵירוֹ וְאֵין בּוֹ כְּדֵי לְהָמִית, וּבָא אַחֵר וֶהֱמִיתוֹ, שֶׁהוּא חַיָּיב.
human_translation: A tanna taught before Rav Sheshet: “And a man who strikes any soul mortally, to include one who strikes another and in which there is not sufficient to kill, and another comes and kills him; that is liable.
llm_translation: The Tanna taught before Rav Sheshet: "And if a man strikes any human soul" - to bring the one who struck his fellow, and he does not have the intent to kill, and another comes and kills him, he is liable.

hebrew_text: אֵין בּוֹ כְּדֵי לְהָמִית? פְּשִׁיטָא! אֶלָּא, יֵשׁ בּוֹ כְּדֵי לְהָמִית וּבָא אַחֵר וֶהֱמִיתוֹ, שֶׁהוּא חַיָּיב. וּסְתָמָא כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בְּתִירָא.
human_translation: there is not sufficient to kill, obvious, Rather, in there is sufficient to kill, and another comes and kills him; that is liable. And unattributed in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira,
llm_translation: There is not enough to kill? Obviously! Rather, there is enough to kill and another came and killed him, so he is liable. And the anonymous Mishna is like Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: הַהוֹרֵג אֶת הַטְּרֵיפָה – פָּטוּר. וּטְרֵיפָה שֶׁהָרַג בִּפְנֵי בֵּית דִּין – חַיָּיב, שֶׁלֹּא בִּפְנֵי בֵּית דִּין – פָּטוּר.
human_translation: Rava says: One who kills a tereifa is exempt And a tereifa who kills before court, liable not before court, exempt.
llm_translation: Rava said: One who kills a treifah is exempt. But a treifah that was killed in front of the court is liable, if not in front of the court, exempt.

hebrew_text: בִּפְנֵי בֵּית דִּין, מַאי טַעְמָא חַיָּיב? דִּכְתִיב: ״וּבִעַרְתָּ הָרָע מִקִּרְבֶּךָ״. שֶׁלֹּא בִּפְנֵי בֵּית דִּין, פָּטוּר, דְּהָוְיָא לַהּ עֵדוּת שֶׁאִי אַתָּה יָכוֹל לַהֲזִימָּהּ, וְכׇל עֵדוּת שֶׁאִי אַתָּה יָכוֹל לַהֲזִימָּהּ – לֹא שְׁמָהּ עֵדוּת.
human_translation: before court, what is the reason liable? as it is written: “And you shall eradicate the evil from your midst” not before court, exempt, as is testimony that you cannot render conspiratory And any testimony that you cannot render conspiratory is not characterized as testimony,
llm_translation: Before the court, what is the reason one is liable? As it is written: "And you shall purge the evil from your midst." If not before the court, one is exempt, for it would be a testimony that you cannot contradict, and any testimony that you cannot contradict - its name is not testimony.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רָבָא: הָרוֹבֵעַ אֶת הַטְּרֵיפָה – חַיָּיב. טְרֵיפָה שֶׁרָבַע, בִּפְנֵי בֵּית דִּין – חַיָּיב, שֶׁלֹּא בִּפְנֵי בֵּית דִּין – פָּטוּר. בִּפְנֵי בֵּית דִּין חַיָּיב, דִּכְתִיב: ״וּבִעַרְתָּ הָרַע מִקִּרְבֶּךָ״. שֶׁלֹּא בִּפְנֵי בֵּית דִּין פָּטוּר, דְּהָוְיָא לַהּ עֵדוּת שֶׁאִי אַתָּה יָכוֹל לַהֲזִימָּהּ.
human_translation: And Rava says: One who sodomizes a tereifa liable And a tereifa who sodomizes before court, liable not before a court, exempt. before court, liable, as it is written: “And you shall eradicate the evil from your midst.” not before a court, exempt, as is testimony that you cannot render conspiratory
llm_translation: And Rava said: One who fattens the treifah animal - is liable. A treifah that he fattened, in front of the court - is liable, that he did not do so in front of the court - is exempt. In front of the court he is liable, as it is written: "And you shall remove the evil from your midst." That he did not do so in front of the court - is exempt, as it would be a testimony that you cannot contradict.

hebrew_text: הָא תּוּ לְמָה לִי? הַיְינוּ הָךְ! הָרוֹבֵעַ אֶת הַטְּרֵיפָה אִיצְטְרִיכָא לֵיהּ. מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: לֶיהֱוֵי כְּמַאן דִּמְשַׁמֵּשׁ מֵת, וְלִיפְּטַר? קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן, דְּמִשּׁוּם הֲנָאָה הוּא, וְהָא אִית לֵיהּ הֲנָאָה.
human_translation: Why do I also this This that It was necessary for him one who sodomizes a tereifa , Lest you say: Let be like one who engages in necrophilia, and let him be exempt teaches us that is due to the pleasure and this has pleasure,
llm_translation: This is what I need it for? That is it! One who quarters a treifah needs it. What might you say: Let it be like one who benefits from a dead person, and be exempt? It is heard to us, that it is for some benefit, and this one has benefit.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רָבָא: עֵדִים שֶׁהֵעִידוּ בִּטְרֵיפָה וְהוּזַּמּוּ, אֵין נֶהֱרָגִין. עֵדֵי טְרֵיפָה שֶׁהוּזַּמּוּ, נֶהֱרָגִין. רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ עֵדֵי טְרֵיפָה שֶׁהוּזַּמּוּ אֵין נֶהֱרָגִין, לְפִי שֶׁאֵינָן בְּזוֹמְמֵי זוֹמְמִין.
human_translation: And Rava says: Witnesses who testified with regard to a tereifa and they were rendered conspiring witnesses are not executed, Witnesses tereifa who were rendered conspiring witnesses are executed. Rav Ashi says: Even witnesses tereifa who were rendered conspiring witnesses are not executed, due to that they are not where witnesses who rendered them conspiring witnesses rendered conspiring witnesses.
llm_translation: And Rava said: Witnesses who testified in a case of treifah and were proven to be conspiring witnesses, they are not executed. Witnesses of a treifah who were proven to be conspiring witnesses, they are executed. Rav Ashi said: Even witnesses of a treifah who were proven to be conspiring witnesses are not executed, because they are not considered conspiring witnesses.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רָבָא: שׁוֹר טְרֵיפָה שֶׁהָרַג – חַיָּיב, וְשׁוֹר שֶׁל אָדָם טְרֵיפָה שֶׁהָרַג – פָּטוּר. מַאי טַעְמָא? אָמַר קְרָא: ״הַשּׁוֹר יִסָּקֵל וְגַם בְּעָלָיו יוּמָת״. כֹּל הֵיכָא דְּקָרֵינָא בֵּיהּ ״וְגַם בְּעָלָיו יוּמָת״, קָרֵינַן בֵּיהּ ״הַשּׁוֹר יִסָּקֵל״, וְכֹל הֵיכָא דְּלָא קָרֵינַן בֵּיהּ ״וְגַם בְּעָלָיו יוּמָת״, לָא קָרֵינַן בֵּיהּ ״הַשּׁוֹר יִסָּקֵל״.
human_translation: And Rava says: An ox a tereifa that killed liable And an ox a person a tereifa that killed exempt. What is the reason the verse states: “The ox shall be stoned and its owner shall also be put to death” Anywhere that we read concerning “And its owner shall also be put to death,” we read, concerning it: “The ox shall be stoned.” And anywhere that we cannot read concerning it: “And its owner shall also be put to death,” we do not read concerning it: “The ox shall be stoned.”
llm_translation: And Rava said: A treifah ox that was killed - liable, and a treifah ox of a person that was killed - exempt. What is the reason? The verse says: "The ox shall be stoned, and its owner shall also be put to death." Wherever we find the phrase "and its owner shall also be put to death" mentioned, we also find the phrase "the ox shall be stoned" mentioned. And wherever we do not find the phrase "and its owner shall also be put to death" mentioned, we do not find the phrase "the ox shall be stoned" mentioned.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ שׁוֹר טְרֵיפָה נָמֵי שֶׁהָרַג – פָּטוּר. מַאי טַעְמָא? כֵּיוָן דְּאִילּוּ בְּעָלִים הֲווֹ פְּטִירִי, שׁוֹר נָמֵי פָּטוּר.
human_translation: Rav Ashi says: Even an ox a tereifa that killed exempt. What is the reason since if the owner he would be exempt, an ox is also exempt.
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: Even a treifah ox, if it was killed – exempt. What is the reason? Since if it had owners, they would be exempt, an ox itself is exempt.

hebrew_text: שִׁיסָּה בּוֹ אֶת הַכֶּלֶב וְכוּ׳. אָמַר רַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב: כְּשֶׁתִּמְצָא לוֹמַר, לְדִבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה – אֶרֶס נָחָשׁ בֵּין שִׁינָּיו הוּא עוֹמֵד. לְפִיכָךְ: מַכִּישׁ בְּסַיִיף, וְנָחָשׁ פָּטוּר.
human_translation: one set a dog against Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov says: When you will find that according to the statement of Rabbi Yehuda, venom of a snake stands within its fangs, Therefore, one who causes bite with a sword and snake exempt.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Shissah bo et ha'kelev v'chu. Amar Rav Acha bar Yaakov: K'shetimtza loimar, l'divrei Rabbi Yehuda - Eres nachash bein shinav hu omed. L'fichach: Makish b'saif, v'nachash patur." English translation: "He whipped it with a sword, etc. Rav Acha bar Yaakov said: When you find him saying, according to the words of Rabbi Yehuda - A snake's nest is between his teeth. Therefore: One strikes with a sword, and the snake is exempt."

hebrew_text: לְדִבְרֵי חֲכָמִים, אֶרֶס נָחָשׁ מֵעַצְמוֹ הוּא מֵקִיא. לְפִיכָךְ: נָחָשׁ בִּסְקִילָה, וְהַמַּכִּישׁ פָּטוּר.
human_translation: According to the statement of the Rabbis, venom of a snake is discharged by itself. Consequently, the snake by stoning, and the one who caused bite exempt
llm_translation: According to the words of the sages, a cedar tree vomits a snake of its own accord. Therefore: if a snake is found in a stone pile, the one who strikes it is exempt.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַמַּכֶּה אֶת חֲבֵירוֹ, בֵּין בְּאֶבֶן בֵּין בְּאֶגְרוֹף, וַאֲמָדוּהוּ לְמִיתָה, וְהֵיקֵל מִמַּה שֶּׁהָיָה, וּלְאַחַר מִכָּאן הִכְבִּיד וָמֵת – חַיָּיב. רַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה אוֹמֵר: פָּטוּר, שֶׁרַגְלַיִם לַדָּבָר.
human_translation: one who strikes another, whether with a stone or with fist, and assessed to death, and eased from what it was, and thereafter worsened and he died, liable Rabbi Neḥemya says: exempt, as there is a basis for the matter
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who strikes his fellow, whether with a stone or with a fist, and they assessed him to be liable to death, and he deteriorated from what he was, and afterward worsened and died - he is liable. Rabbi Nechemiah says: He is exempt, for the matter is dependent on the legs.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אֶת זוֹ דָּרַשׁ רַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה, ״אִם יָקוּם וְהִתְהַלֵּךְ בַּחוּץ
human_translation: The Sages taught: Rabbi Neḥemya interpreted this “If he rises and walks outside
llm_translation: The Sages taught: Rabbi Nechemiah expounded this verse, "If he rises and walks outside..."

hebrew_text: עַל מִשְׁעַנְתּוֹ וְנִקָּה הַמַּכֶּה״. וְכִי תַּעֲלֶה עַל דַּעְתְּךָ שֶׁזֶּה מְהַלֵּךְ בַּשּׁוּק וְזֶה נֶהֱרָג? אֶלָּא זֶה שֶׁאֲמָדוּהוּ לְמִיתָה, וְהֵקֵל מִמַּה שֶּׁהָיָה, וּלְאַחַר כָּךְ הִכְבִּיד וָמֵת – שֶׁהוּא פָּטוּר.
human_translation: upon his staff, then he that struck him is absolved; would it enter your mind that this is walking in the marketplace, and that will be executed Rather, this where assessed to death, and eased from what it was and thereafter worsened and he died, that he is exempt.
llm_translation: "On his support and he is acquitted of striking." And would you suggest in your opinion that this one walks in the marketplace and this one is killed? Rather, this is one whom they sentenced to death, and he was lightened from what he was, and afterwards he worsened and died - he is exempt.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן, הַאי ״וְנִקָּה הַמַּכֶּה״ מַאי דָּרְשִׁי בֵּיהּ? מְלַמֵּד שֶׁחוֹבְשִׁין אוֹתוֹ.
human_translation: And the Rabbis what do they interpret from that “Then he that struck him is absolved”? teaches that they incarcerate him
llm_translation: The sages, this "and he shall be acquitted who struck," what did he expound in it? It teaches that they bandage him.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה, חֲבִישָׁה מְנָא לֵיהּ? יָלֵיף מִמְּקוֹשֵׁשׁ.
human_translation: And Rabbi Neḥemya, from where does he incarceration? He derives it from gatherer
llm_translation: Rabbi Nechemiah, a garment is counted for him? It is derived from "mikosheish."

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן נָמֵי לֵילְפוּ מִמְּקוֹשֵׁשׁ? מְקוֹשֵׁשׁ בַּר קְטָלָא הוּא, וּמֹשֶׁה לָא הֲוָה יָדַע קְטָלֵיהּ בְּמַאי. לְאַפּוֹקֵי הַאי, דְּלָא יָדְעִינַן אִי בַּר קְטָלָא הוּא אִי לָאו בַּר קְטָלָא הוּא.
human_translation: And the Rabbis too, let them derive from gatherer. gatherer, was liable to be killed, and Moses did not know with what his death to the exclusion of this whom we do not know if he is liable to be killed if he is not liable to be killed.
llm_translation: The sages said: Did the Rabbanan learn from Mekosheish? Mekosheish was a wizard, and Moses did not know how to kill him. To resolve this, we must ascertain whether he was a wizard or not a wizard.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה יָלֵיף מִמְּגַדֵּף, דְּלָא הֲוָה יָדַע אִי בַּר קְטָלָא הוּא, וְחַבְשׁוּהּ.
human_translation: And Rabbi Neḥemya, derives from the blasphemer did not know if he was liable to be killed, and imprisoned
llm_translation: Rabbi Nechemiah would derive a law from a blasphemer, for he did not know if he was a son of a halakhicly unfit marriage, and they bound him.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן: מְגַדֵּף – הוֹרָאַת שָׁעָה הָיְתָה.
human_translation: And the Rabbis, blasphemer was a provisional edict.
llm_translation: And the Rabbis: "Megadef" - it was a temporary teaching.

hebrew_text: כִּדְתַנְיָא: יוֹדֵעַ הָיָה מֹשֶׁה רַבֵּינוּ שֶׁהַמְקוֹשֵׁשׁ בְּמִיתָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״מְחַלְּלֶיהָ מוֹת יוּמָת״, אֶלָּא לֹא הָיָה יוֹדֵעַ בְּאֵיזוֹ מִיתָה נֶהֱרָג, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי לֹא פֹרַשׁ וְגוֹ׳״. אֲבָל מְגַדֵּף לֹא נֶאֱמַר בּוֹ אֶלָּא ״לִפְרֹשׁ לָהֶם עַל פִּי ה׳״, שֶׁלֹּא הָיָה מֹשֶׁה יוֹדֵעַ אִם הוּא בֶּן מִיתָה כׇּל עִיקָּר אִם לָאו.
human_translation: as it is taught Moses our teacher knew that the gatherer to death, as it is stated: one who desecrates it shall be put to death” But he did not know with which death he was killed, as it is stated: as it had not been declared But blasphemer it is stated only: that it might be declared to them according to the Lord” as Moses did not know if was liable to be killed at all, or not.
llm_translation: As it was taught: Moses our teacher knew that the one who violates the Shabbat is liable to the death penalty, as it is stated: "He who profanes it shall surely be put to death." However, he did not know by which method of execution he would be killed, as it is stated: "For he had not made clear." But regarding a blasphemer, it does not say about him, rather "to declare to them by the word of the Lord," for Moses did not know if he was liable to the death penalty at all.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה, הַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיבִי תְּרֵי אוּמְדָּנֵי: חַד – אֲמָדוּהוּ לְמִיתָה וְחָיָה, וְחַד – אֲמָדוּהוּ לְמִיתָה וְהֵקֵל מִמַּה שֶּׁהָיָה. אֶלָּא לְרַבָּנַן, תְּרֵי אוּמְדָּנֵי לְמָה לִי?
human_translation: Granted, according to Rabbi Neḥemya, that is that two assessments are written. One verse they assessed to death, and he recovered and one verse they assessed to death, and eased from what it was But according to the Rabbis, why do I two assessments?
llm_translation: In truth, according to Rabbi Nechemiah, that is what is written: two pillars: one - they established him for death and he lived, and one - they established him for death and he was acquitted from what he was accused of. But according to the Rabbis, why do I need two pillars?

hebrew_text: חַד אֲמָדוּהוּ לְמִיתָה וְחָיָה, וְחַד אֲמָדוּהוּ לְחַיִּים וָמֵת.
human_translation: one they assessed to death and he recovered And one they assessed to life and he died,
llm_translation: One supported him for death and he lived, and one supported him for life and he died.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה, אֲמָדוּהוּ לְחַיִּים וָמֵת – לָא צְרִיךְ קְרָא, שֶׁהֲרֵי יָצָא מִבֵּית דִּין זַכַּאי.
human_translation: And Rabbi Neḥemya, they assessed to life, and he died, one does not need verse as he emerged from the court innocent
llm_translation: Rabbi Nechemiah, they stood him up for life and he died - no need for a verse, for he left the court innocent.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הַמַּכֶּה אֶת חֲבֵירוֹ, וַאֲמָדוּהוּ לְמִיתָה, וְחָיָה – פּוֹטְרִין אוֹתוֹ. אֲמָדוּהוּ לְמִיתָה וְהֵקֵל מִמַּה שֶּׁהָיָה – אוֹמְדִין אוֹתוֹ אוֹמֶד שֵׁנִי לְמָמוֹן. וְאִם לְאַחַר כֵּן הִכְבִּיד וָמֵת – הַלֵּךְ אַחַר אוֹמֶד הָאֶמְצָעִי, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֵין אוֹמֶד אַחַר אוֹמֶד.
human_translation: The Sages taught: one who strikes another and they assessed to death, and he recovered exempts they assessed to death and eased from what it was, they assess a second assessment to monetary restitution And if thereafter worsened and he died, Follow the assessment the intermediate the statement of Rabbi Neḥemya. And the Rabbis say: There is no assessment after assessment.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: One who strikes his fellow, and they assessed him to be liable to death, and he survived - they exempt him. If they assessed him to be liable to death and he became lighter from what he was - they assess him or assess a second one for monetary payment. And if afterwards he deteriorated and died - follow the middle assessment, the words of Rabbi Nechemiah. And the Sages say: One does not follow one assessment after another.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא אִידַּךְ: אֲמָדוּהוּ לְמִיתָה – אוֹמְדִין אוֹתוֹ לְחַיִּים. לְחַיִּים – אֵין אוֹמְדִין אוֹתוֹ לְמִיתָה. אֲמָדוּהוּ לְמִיתָה וְהֵקֵל מִמַּה שֶּׁהָיָה – אוֹמְדִין אוֹתוֹ אוֹמֶד שֵׁנִי לְמָמוֹן, וְאִם לְאַחַר כֵּן הִכְבִּיד וָמֵת – מְשַׁלֵּם נֶזֶק וָצַעַר לַיּוֹרְשִׁים.
human_translation: It is taught another they assessed to death, they assess to life. they assessed to life, they do not assess to death, they assessed to death, and eased from what it was, they assess a second assessment to monetary restitution And if thereafter worsened and he died, pays to the heirs injury and suffering
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: The other opinion says: If they have sentenced him to death - they postpone him for life. For life - they do not postpone him for death. If they have sentenced him to death and then lightened his sentence from what it was - they postpone him or they assess a second penalty for money. And if afterwards he deteriorated and died - he pays damages and pain to his heirs.

hebrew_text: מֵאֵימָתַי מְשַׁלֵּם? מִשָּׁעָה שֶׁהִכָּהוּ. וּסְתָמָא כְּרַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה.
human_translation: From when pays? from the moment that struck him. And unattributed is in accordance with Rabbi Neḥemya,
llm_translation: From when does one pay? From the time he strikes him. And presumably this is like Rabbi Nechemiah.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ נִתְכַּוֵּין לַהֲרוֹג אֶת הַבְּהֵמָה, וְהָרַג אֶת הָאָדָם; לַנׇּכְרִי, וְהָרַג אֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל; לַנְּפָלִים, וְהָרַג אֶת בֶּן קַיָּימָא – פָּטוּר.
human_translation: intended to kill an animal, and he killed a person to a gentile, and he killed a Jew, to non-viable newborns, and he killed a viable person, exempt
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: If one intended to kill an animal, but ended up killing a person; intended to kill a non-Jew, but ended up killing a Jew; intended to kill an idolater, but ended up killing a Ben Kayyama - he is exempt.

hebrew_text: נִתְכַּוֵּין לְהַכּוֹתוֹ עַל מׇתְנָיו, וְלֹא הָיָה בָּהּ כְּדֵי לַהֲמִיתוֹ עַל מׇתְנָיו, וְהָלְכָה לָהּ עַל לִבּוֹ, וְהָיָה בָּהּ כְּדֵי לַהֲמִיתוֹ עַל לִבּוֹ, וָמֵת – פָּטוּר. נִתְכַּוֵּין לְהַכּוֹתוֹ עַל לִבּוֹ
human_translation: intended to strike on his loins, and was not enough to kill him on his loins, but on heart, and it was enough to kill him on his heart, and died exempt he intended to strike him on his heart
llm_translation: He intended to strike him on his loins, and there was not enough to kill him on his loins, and the law goes by his heart, and there was enough to kill him on his heart, and he died - he is exempt. He intended to strike him on his heart.

hebrew_text: וְהָיָה בָּהּ כְּדֵי לְהָמִית עַל לִבּוֹ, וְהָלְכָה לָהּ עַל מׇתְנָיו, וְלֹא הָיָה בָּהּ כְּדֵי לְהָמִית עַל מׇתְנָיו, וָמֵת – פָּטוּר.
human_translation: and was enough to kill him on his heart, and landed on his loins, and it was not enough to kill him on his loins, and died, exempt.
llm_translation: And it was in it, the time to kill upon his heart, and it went upon his loins, and it was not in it the time to kill upon his loins, and he died - he is exempt.

hebrew_text: נִתְכַּוֵּון לְהַכּוֹת אֶת הַגָּדוֹל, וְלֹא הָיָה בָּהּ כְּדֵי לְהָמִית הַגָּדוֹל, וְהָלְכָה לָהּ עַל הַקָּטָן, וְהָיָה בָּהּ כְּדֵי לְהָמִית אֶת הַקָּטָן, וָמֵת – פָּטוּר. נִתְכַּוֵּן לְהַכּוֹת אֶת הַקָּטָן, וְהָיָה בָּהּ כְּדֵי לְהָמִית אֶת הַקָּטָן, וְהָלְכָה לָהּ עַל הַגָּדוֹל, וְלֹא הָיָה בָּהּ כְּדֵי לְהָמִית אֶת הַגָּדוֹל, וָמֵת – פָּטוּר.
human_translation: one intended to kill an adult and was not enough to kill the adult, blow landed on a minor, and was enough to kill the minor and died, exempt. one intended to kill a minor and was enough to kill a minor, and landed on an adult and was not enough to kill the adult, and died, exempt.
llm_translation: He intended to strike the adult, and it did not contain enough to kill the adult, and the law applies to the minor, and it contained enough to kill the minor, and he died - he is exempt. He intended to strike the minor, and it contained enough to kill the minor, and the law applies to the adult, and it did not contain enough to kill the adult, and he died - he is exempt.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל נִתְכַּוֵּון לְהַכּוֹת עַל מׇתְנָיו, וְהָיָה בָּהּ כְּדֵי לְהָמִית עַל מׇתְנָיו, וְהָלְכָה לָהּ עַל לִבּוֹ, וָמֵת – חַיָּיב. נִתְכַּוֵּון לְהַכּוֹת אֶת הַגָּדוֹל, וְהָיָה בָּהּ כְּדֵי לְהָמִית אֶת הַגָּדוֹל, וְהָלְכָה לָהּ עַל הַקָּטָן, וָמֵת – חַיָּיב. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: אֲפִילּוּ נִתְכַּוֵּון לַהֲרוֹג אֶת זֶה וְהָרַג אֶת זֶה – פָּטוּר.
human_translation: But one intended to strike on his loins, and was enough to kill him on his loins, and landed on his heart, and he died, liable, one intended to strike an adult and was enough to kill the adult, and landed on a minor and he died, liable. Rabbi Shimon says: Even one intended to kill this and he killed that exempt,
llm_translation: But if one intended to strike on his thigh, and it was sufficient to kill on his thigh, and the blow reached his heart, and he died - he is liable. If one intended to strike the adult, and it was sufficient to kill the adult, and the blow reached the minor, and he died - he is liable. Rabbi Shimon says: Even if one intended to kill this person and killed that person - he is exempt.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אַהֵיָיא? אִילֵּימָא אַסֵּיפָא, ״רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן פּוֹטֵר״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ!
human_translation: With regard to which Rabbi Shimon If we say with the latter clause should have Rabbi Shimon exempts
llm_translation: Gemara: Is it so that Rabbi Shimon Ahaiya said? If you say the latter part, "Rabbi Shimon exempts," who requires it from him!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אַרֵישָׁא: נִתְכַּוֵּון לַהֲרוֹג אֶת הַבְּהֵמָה וְהָרַג אֶת הָאָדָם, לַנׇּכְרִי וְהָרַג אֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל, לַנְּפָלִים וְהָרַג אֶת בֶּן קַיָּימָא – פָּטוּר. הָא נִתְכַּוֵּון לַהֲרוֹג אֶת זֶה וְהָרַג אֶת זֶה – חַיָּיב. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: אֲפִילּוּ נִתְכַּוֵּין לַהֲרוֹג אֶת זֶה וְהָרַג אֶת זֶה – פָּטוּר.
human_translation: Rather, with the first clause one intended to kill an animal, and he killed a person, to a gentile and he killed a Jew, to non-viable newborns and he killed a viable person, exempt But one intended to kill this and he killed that liable. Rabbi Shimon says: Even one intended to kill this and he killed that exempt.
llm_translation: First: If one intended to kill an animal and ended up killing a person, or intended to kill a non-Jew and ended up killing a Jew, or intended to kill an idolater and ended up killing a Jew, he is exempt. But if one intended to kill this person and ended up killing that person, he is liable. Rabbi Shimon says: Even if one intended to kill this person and ended up killing that person, he is exempt.

hebrew_text: פְּשִׁיטָא! קָאֵי רְאוּבֵן וְשִׁמְעוֹן, וְאָמַר: ״אֲנָא לִרְאוּבֵן קָא מִיכַּוַּונָא, לְשִׁמְעוֹן לָא קָא מִיכַּוַּונָא״ – הַיְינוּ פְּלוּגְתַּיְיהוּ. אָמַר: ״לְחַד מִינַּיְיהוּ״ – מַאי? אִי נָמֵי, כְּסָבוּר רְאוּבֵן וְנִמְצָא שִׁמְעוֹן – מַאי? תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּתַנְיָא: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר, עַד שֶׁיֹּאמַר ״לִפְלוֹנִי אֲנִי מִתְכַּוֵּון״.
human_translation: Reuven and Shimon were standing, and said: I intend to Reuven, I do not intend to Shimon, obvious this is the dispute said: to one of them, what Alternatively, he thought Reuven and he was found Shimon, what Come hear as it is taught Rabbi Shimon says: until he says: I intend to so-and-so,
llm_translation: It is obvious! Reuven and Shimon are standing, and he said: "I am directing myself to Reuven, not to Shimon" – this is their disagreement. He said: "To one of them" – what is it? If so, if Reuven thinks and Shimon is found – what is it? Come and hear, as it was taught: Rabbi Shimon says, until one says, "I intend for so-and-so."

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן? אָמַר קְרָא: ״וְאָרַב לוֹ וְקָם עָלָיו״, עַד שֶׁיִּתְכַּוֵּון לוֹ. וְרַבָּנַן, אָמְרִי דְּבֵי רַבִּי יַנַּאי: פְּרָט לְזוֹרֵק אֶבֶן לְגוֹ.
human_translation: What is the reason of Rabbi Shimon? The verse states: “But if there will be a man who hates his neighbor, and he lies in wait for him and rises up against him, until he intends to him, And the Rabbis, the school of Rabbi Yannai say to the exclusion of casts a stone into the midst
llm_translation: What is the reason for Rabbi Shimon's opinion? The verse says: "And he shall lie in wait for him, and rise up against him," until he intends for him. And the Rabbis say in the school of Rabbi Yannai: This excludes one who throws a stone at him.

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִילֵּימָא דְּאִיכָּא תִּשְׁעָה גּוֹיִם וְאֶחָד יִשְׂרָאֵל בֵּינֵיהֶן, תִּיפּוֹק לֵיהּ דְּרוּבָּא גּוֹיִם נִינְהוּ. אִי נָמֵי פַּלְגָא וּפַלְגָא, סְפֵק נְפָשׁוֹת לְהָקֵל.
human_translation: What are the circumstances? If we say that there are nine gentiles and one Jew among them, derive that they are a majority of gentiles, Alternatively, half and half uncertainty capital to be lenient,
llm_translation: How are they similar? Perhaps because there are nine non-Jews and one Jew among them, the majority are considered like non-Jews. If so, half and half, there is a doubt regarding his life to be lenient.

hebrew_text: לָא צְרִיכָא, דְּאִיכָּא תִּשְׁעָה יִשְׂרָאֵל וְגוֹי אֶחָד בֵּינֵיהֶן, דְּהָוֵה לֵיהּ גּוֹי קָבוּעַ, וְכׇל קָבוּעַ כְּמֶחֱצָה עַל מֶחֱצָה דָּמֵי.
human_translation: No, necessary where there are nine Jews and one gentile among them, as gentile is a fixed and any fixed is like equally balanced,
llm_translation: Not necessary, for there are nine Jews and one gentile among them, for he is considered a fixed gentile, and all fixed individuals are considered as half and half in terms of blood.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַבָּנַן דְּאָמְרִי: נִתְכַּוֵּון לַהֲרוֹג אֶת זֶה וְהָרַג אֶת זֶה – חַיָּיב, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְכִי יִנָּצוּ אֲנָשִׁים וְנָגְפוּ אִשָּׁה הָרָה״. וְאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: בְּמַצּוּת שֶׁבְּמִיתָה הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר, דִּכְתִיב: ״אִם אָסוֹן יִהְיֶה וְנָתַתָּה נֶפֶשׁ תַּחַת נָפֶשׁ״.
human_translation: Granted, according to the Rabbis, who say one intended to kill this and he killed that liable, which is written: “If men struggle and they hurt a pregnant woman And Rabbi Elazar says: with regard to a quarrel that involves death the verse is speaking, as it is written: “But if there shall be a tragedy then you shall give a life for a life”
llm_translation: In truth, according to the sages who say: If one intends to kill this person, but ends up killing another – he is liable, as it is written: "And if men struggle with each other and strike a pregnant woman." And Rabbi Elazar said: In the case of a commandment related to capital punishment, the verse speaks, as it is written: "If there is harm, then you shall give life for life."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, הַאי ״וְנָתַתָּה נֶפֶשׁ תַּחַת נָפֶשׁ״ מַאי עָבֵיד לֵיהּ? מָמוֹן. וְכִדְרַבִּי, דְּתַנְיָא: רַבִּי אוֹמֵר, ״וְנָתַתָּה נֶפֶשׁ תַּחַת נָפֶשׁ״ – מָמוֹן. אַתָּה אוֹמֵר מָמוֹן, אוֹ אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא נֶפֶשׁ מַמָּשׁ? נֶאֶמְרָה נְתִינָה לְמַטָּה, וְנֶאֶמְרָה
human_translation: But according to Rabbi Shimon, this “Then you shall give a life for a life,” what does he do with it? monetary restitution. And in accordance with of Rabbi as it is taught Rabbi says “then you shall give a life for a life” monetary restitution Do you say monetary restitution, or it only an actual life? giving is stated below: And is stated
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rather, for Rabbi Shimon, this "and you shall give a life for a life," what does it do for him? Money. And like Rabbi, as it was taught: Rabbi says, "and you shall give a life for a life" – money. Do you say money, or is it only actual life? It was said to give below, and it was said English translation:

hebrew_text: נְתִינָה לְמַעְלָה: מָה לְהַלָּן מָמוֹן, אַף כָּאן מָמוֹן.
human_translation: giving above: Just as there, monetary restitution, so too here, monetary restitution.
llm_translation: Placement above: What is money there, so too money here.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: הָאי דְּתָנָא דְּבֵי חִזְקִיָּה מַפְּקָא מִדְּרַבִּי, וּמַפְּקָא מִדְּרַבָּנַן. דְּתָנָא דְּבֵי חִזְקִיָּה: ״מַכֵּה אָדָם״ וּ״מַכֵּה בְּהֵמָה״.
human_translation: Rava says: That the school of Ḥizkiyya taught diverges from of Rabbi and diverges from of the Rabbis. As the school of Ḥizkiyya taught: one who kills a man and one who kills an animal
llm_translation: Rava said: This teaching of the school of Hezekiah is derived from Rabbi, and derived from the Rabbis. The teaching of the school of Hezekiah: "One who strikes a man" and "One who strikes an animal."

hebrew_text: מָה מַכֵּה בְּהֵמָה לֹא חִלַּקְתָּ בָּהּ בֵּין שׁוֹגֵג לְמֵזִיד, בֵּין מִתְכַּוֵּין לְשֶׁאֵינוֹ מִתְכַּוֵּין, בֵּין דֶּרֶךְ יְרִידָה לְדֶרֶךְ עֲלִיָּיה – לְפוֹטְרוֹ מָמוֹן אֶלָּא לְחַיְּיבוֹ מָמוֹן. אַף מַכֵּה אָדָם לֹא תַּחְלוֹק בּוֹ בֵּין שׁוֹגֵג לְמֵזִיד, בֵּין מִתְכַּוֵּין לְשֶׁאֵין מִתְכַּוֵּין, בֵּין דֶּרֶךְ יְרִידָה לְדֶרֶךְ עֲלִיָּיה – לְחַיְּיבוֹ מָמוֹן אֶלָּא לְפוֹטְרוֹ מָמוֹן.
human_translation: just as one who kills an animal, did not differentiate whether unwittingly or intentionally, whether with intent or with no intent, whether in a downward motion or in an upward motion, to exempt him from monetary restitution rather to render him liable monetary restitution, similarly, with regard to one who kills a person, do not differentiate concerning him whether unwittingly or unintentionally, whether with intent or with no intent, whether in a downward motion or in an upward motion, to render him liable monetary restitution rather to exempt him from monetary restitution
llm_translation: The one who strikes an animal, you do not differentiate in it between unintentional and intentional, between one who intended and one who did not intend, between descending and ascending – to exempt him from payment but to obligate him in payment. Likewise, one who strikes a person, you do not differentiate in him between unintentional and intentional, between one who intended and one who did not intend, between descending and ascending – to obligate him in payment but to exempt him from payment.

hebrew_text: מַאי ״שֶׁאֵין מִתְכַּוֵּין״? אִילֵּימָא שֶׁאֵין מִתְכַּוֵּין כְּלָל – הַיְינוּ שׁוֹגֵג! אֶלָּא פְּשִׁיטָא שֶׁאֵין מִתְכַּוֵּין לָזֶה אֶלָּא לָזֶה, וְקָתָנֵי לְחַיְּיבוֹ מָמוֹן אֶלָּא לְפוֹטְרוֹ מָמוֹן. וְאִי בַּר קְטָלָא הוּא, מַאי אִיצְטְרִיךְ לְמִיפְטְרֵיהּ מָמוֹן?
human_translation: What is with no intent? If we say that he had no intent at all that is unwitting Rather, obvious one who does not intend to this but to that And it is taught: to render him liable monetary restitution rather to exempt him from monetary restitution. And if liable to be executed, what was necessary to exempt him monetary restitution?
llm_translation: What is "she'ein mitkavin"? If you say that "she'ein mitkavin" is not at all - that means unintentional! Rather, it is obvious that "she'ein mitkavin" is not intending for this specifically, but for that specifically, and the Mishnah teaches to obligate him in payment not to exempt him from payment. And if it is a poor person, why does he need to exempt him from payment?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, לָאו שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: לָאו בַּר קְטָלָא הוּא, וְלָאו בַּר מָמוֹנָא הוּא.
human_translation: Rather, not conclude from it he is neither liable to be executed, nor is he liable monetary restitution.
llm_translation: Rather, it is not a valid deduction from it: he is not a son of a murderer, and he is not a son of a money changer.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ רוֹצֵחַ שֶׁנִּתְעָרֵב בַּאֲחֵרִים – כּוּלָּן פְּטוּרִין. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: כּוֹנְסִין אוֹתָן לַכִּיפָּה.
human_translation: a murderer who was intermingled with others all of them are exempt Rabbi Yehuda says: gathers them into the vaulted chamber [ lakippa ]
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: A murderer who conspired with others - all of them are exempt. Rabbi Yehuda says: They are all gathered for the atonement.

hebrew_text: כׇּל חַיָּיבֵי מִיתוֹת שֶׁנִּתְעָרְבוּ זֶה בָּזֶה – נִידּוֹנִין בַּקַּלָּה. הַנִּסְקָלִין בַּנִּשְׂרָפִין – רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: נִידּוֹנִין בִּסְקִילָה, שֶׁהַשְּׂרֵיפָה חֲמוּרָה. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: נִידּוֹנִין בִּשְׂרֵיפָה, שֶׁהַסְּקִילָה חֲמוּרָה.
human_translation: all liable to death who became intermingled with each other they are sentenced to the lenient who are stoned with who are burned, Rabbi Shimon says: They are sentenced by stoning, as burning severe And the Rabbis say: They are sentenced by burning, as stoning severe
llm_translation: All those liable to death penalties who became mixed up with each other - are judged by stoning. Those who are stoned and then burned - Rabbi Shimon says: they are judged by stoning, for burning is severe. And the Sages say: they are judged by burning, for stoning is severe.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָהֶן רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: אִילּוּ לֹא הָיְתָה שְׂרֵיפָה חֲמוּרָה, לֹא נִתְּנָה לְבַת כֹּהֵן שֶׁזִּנְּתָה. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: אִילּוּ לֹא הָיְתָה סְקִילָה חֲמוּרָה, לֹא נִתְּנָה לִמְגַדֵּף וּלְעוֹבֵד עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon said to If burning were not more severe it would not have been administered to a priest’s daughter who committed adultery. said to If stoning were not more severe it would not have been administered to a blasphemer and to an idol worshipper,
llm_translation: He said to them Rabbi Shimon: If there had not been a severe burning, the daughter of a priest who committed adultery would not have been given. They said to him: If there had not been a severe stoning, a blasphemer and one who worships foreign gods would not have been given.

hebrew_text: הַנֶּהֱרָגִין בַּנֶּחְנָקִין, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: בְּסַיִיף, וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: בְּחֶנֶק.
human_translation: who are killed with who are strangled, Rabbi Shimon says: They are sentenced with a sword, And the Rabbis say: They are sentenced by strangulation,
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "The ones who are killed by strangulation, Rabbi Shimon says: by sword, and the Sages say: by strangulation."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאן אֲחֵרִים? אִילֵּימָא אֲחֵרִים כְּשֵׁרִים, פְּשִׁיטָא! וְתוּ, בְּהָא לֵימָא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: כּוֹנְסִין אוֹתָן לְכִיפָּה?
human_translation: Who are the others If we say the others are upstanding obvious And furthermore, shall Rabbi Yehuda say in that gathers them into the vaulted chamber
llm_translation: Gemara: Who are the "others"? Perhaps "others" are valid, it is obvious! And furthermore, in this regard Rabbi Yehuda said: Do we gather them for the covering?

hebrew_text: (סימן בשק״ר).
human_translation: a mnemonic, beit , shin , reish , kuf ,
llm_translation: Tractate: (Siman B'Shakar). (

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הָכָא בְּרוֹצֵחַ שֶׁלֹּא נִגְמַר דִּינוֹ, שֶׁנִּתְעָרֵב בְּרוֹצְחִים אֲחֵרִים שֶׁנִּגְמַר דִּינָן, עָסְקִינַן. רַבָּנַן סָבְרִי: אֵין גּוֹמְרִין דִּינוֹ שֶׁל אָדָם אֶלָּא בְּפָנָיו, הִלְכָּךְ כּוּלָּן פְּטוּרִין. וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה: מִיפְטְרִינְהוּ לִגְמָרֵי נָמֵי לָא, כֵּיוָן דְּרוֹצְחִין נִינְהוּ. הִלְכָּךְ כּוֹנְסִין אוֹתָן לַכִּיפָּה.
human_translation: Rabbi Abbahu says Shmuel says: Here we are dealing with a murderer his verdict was not finalized; was intermingled with other murderers whose verdicts were finalized. The Rabbis hold finalizes a person’s verdict only in his presence. therefore, they are all exempt. And Rabbi Yehuda Completely exempting them is also not since they are murderers. Therefore, gathers them into the vaulted chamber.
llm_translation: Rabbi Avahu said in the name of Shmuel: Here in the case of a murderer whose trial has not concluded, who became mixed up with other murderers whose trial has concluded, we engage. The Rabbis hold: We do not conclude the trial of a person except in his presence, therefore all of them are exempt. And Rabbi Yehudah: We exempt them completely, for they are considered murderers. Therefore, we gather them for the death penalty.

hebrew_text: רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר: בְּאָדָם, דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דִּפְטִירִי. אֲבָל הָכָא, בְּשׁוֹר שֶׁלֹּא נִגְמַר דִּינוֹ שֶׁנִּתְעָרֵב בִּשְׁוָרִים אֲחֵרִים שֶׁנִּגְמַר דִּינָן, קָמִיפַּלְגִי. רַבָּנַן סָבְרִי: כְּמִיתַת בְּעָלִים כָּךְ מִיתַת הַשּׁוֹר, וְאֵין גּוֹמְרִין דִּינוֹ שֶׁל שׁוֹר אֶלָּא בְּפָנָיו, הִלְכָּךְ כּוּלָּן פְּטוּרִין. וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה סָבַר: כּוֹנְסִין אוֹתָן לַכִּיפָּה.
human_translation: Reish Lakish says: In a person everyone agrees that they are exempt, But here, with regard to an ox whose verdict was not finalized, that was intermingled with other oxen whose verdict was finalized, they disagree. The Rabbis hold like the death of the owner, so is the death of the ox, and finalizes the verdict of an ox only in its presence. Therefore, all are exempt. And Rabbi Yehuda holds gathers them into the vaulted chamber.
llm_translation: Reish Lakish said: In the case of a person, since everyone in the world does not dispute that he will eventually die, there is no disagreement. But here, in the case of an ox that has not yet completed its judgment and became mixed with other oxen whose judgment has been completed, they disagree. The Rabbis hold: Just as the death of the owner is like the death of the ox, and we only conclude the judgment of the ox in his presence, therefore all are exempt. And Rabbi Yehuda holds: We gather them for stoning.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא:
human_translation: Rava says:
llm_translation: Rava said:

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, הַיְינוּ דְּקָתָנֵי עֲלַהּ: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: אֲפִילּוּ אַבָּא חֲלַפְתָּא בֵּינֵיהֶן?
human_translation: If so, that which is taught with regard to Rabbi Yosei says: even Abba Ḥalafta, among them?
llm_translation: So it is, that is what is taught about the leaf: Rabbi Yosei said: Even if Abba Chalfata stood between them?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: הָכִי קָאָמַר, שְׁנַיִם שֶׁהָיוּ עוֹמְדִין, וְיָצָא חֵץ מִבֵּינֵיהֶם וְהָרַג – שְׁנֵיהֶם פְּטוּרִין. וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: אֲפִילּוּ אַבָּא חֲלַפְתָּא בֵּינֵיהֶן.
human_translation: Rather, Rava says: This is saying: two were standing and an arrow emerged from their midst and killed both of them are exempt. And Rabbi Yosei says: even Abba Ḥalafta was among them.
llm_translation: Rava said: Thus he said, two who were standing, and an arrow went out from between them and killed - both of them are exempt. And Rabbi Yosei said: Even if Abba Chalfata was among them.

hebrew_text: וְשׁוֹר שֶׁנִּגְמַר דִּינוֹ, שֶׁנִּתְעָרֵב בִּשְׁוָורִין אֲחֵרִים מְעַלְּיֵי – סוֹקְלִין אוֹתָן. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: כּוֹנְסִין אוֹתָן לַכִּיפָּה.
human_translation: And an ox whose verdict was finalized, that was intermingled with other ordinary oxen, stones them. Rabbi Yehuda says: They are placed in a vaulted chamber.
llm_translation: "And an ox whose judgment has been completed, that it became mixed with other oxen - we stone them. Rabbi Yehuda says: We gather them for the pen."

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא: פָּרָה שֶׁהֵמִיתָה וְאַחַר כָּךְ יָלְדָה, אִם עַד שֶׁלֹּא נִגְמַר דִּינָה יָלְדָה – וְולָדָהּ מוּתָּר, אִם מִשֶּׁנִּגְמַר דִּינָה יָלְדָה – וְולָדָהּ אָסוּר. נִתְעָרֵב בַּאֲחֵרִים וַאֲחֵרִים בַּאֲחֵרִים – כּוֹנְסִין אוֹתָן לַכִּיפָּה. רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: מְבִיאִין אוֹתָן לְבֵית דִּין וְסוֹקְלִין אוֹתָן.
human_translation: And it is taught a cow that killed and thereafter calved, if before its verdict was finalized calved, its offspring is permitted. If after its verdict was finalized calved, its offspring is prohibited, was intermingled with other and other with others, gathers them into a vaulted chamber. Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, says: One brings them to court and stones them.
llm_translation: And it was taught in a Baraita: A cow that was killed and then gave birth, if she gave birth before her judgment was completed - her offspring is permitted. If she gave birth after her judgment was completed - her offspring is forbidden. If she mixed with others, and others mixed with others - they gather them for stoning. Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, says: They bring them to the court and stone them.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: אִם עַד שֶׁלֹּא נִגְמַר דִּינָה יָלְדָה, וְולָדָהּ מוּתָּר. וְאַף עַל גַּב דְּכִי נְגַחָה הֲוָת מְיעַבְּרָה? וְהָאָמַר רָבָא: וְלַד הַנּוֹגַחַת אָסוּר – הִיא וּוְלָדָהּ נָגְחוּ; וְלַד הַנִּרְבַּעַת אָסוּר – הִיא וּוְלָדָהּ נִרְבְּעוּ!
human_translation: The Master says If calved before its verdict was finalized, its offspring is permitted. And even though when it gored it was pregnant? But doesn’t Rava say the offspring of that gores prohibited and its offspring gored the offspring that was the object of bestiality prohibited and its offspring the object of bestiality
llm_translation: Master said: If until not finished her judgment she gave birth, and her offspring permissible. And even though when she struggled was she miscarried? And Rava said: A child of a woman struggling is forbidden - she and her offspring struggled; and a child of a woman who was trampled is forbidden - she and her offspring were trampled!

hebrew_text: אֵימָא: אִם עַד שֶׁלֹּא נִגְמַר דִּינָה עִיבְּרָה וְיָלְדָה – וְולָדָהּ מוּתָּר; אִם מִשֶּׁנִּגְמַר דִּינָה עִיבְּרָה וְיָלְדָה – וְולָדָהּ אָסוּר.
human_translation: say If before its verdict was finalized was impregnated and calved, its offspring is permitted; if after its verdict was finalized was impregnated and calved, its offspring is forbidden
llm_translation: Mother: If until not finished her judgment she became pregnant and gave birth - and her child is permissible; if after finished her judgment she became pregnant and gave birth - her child is forbidden.

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר: זֶה וָזֶה גּוֹרֵם – אָסוּר.
human_translation: This works out well according to the one who says this and that cause forbidden.
llm_translation: The one who says: "This and that cause it" - forbidden.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר: זֶה וָזֶה גּוֹרֵם – מוּתָּר, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר?
human_translation: But according to the one who says this and that cause permitted, what can be said?
llm_translation: Rather, according to the one who says: "Both this and that cause it," it is permitted. What is there to say?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבִינָא: אֵימָא, אִם עַד שֶׁלֹּא נִגְמַר דִּינָה עִיבְּרָה וְיָלְדָה – וְלָדָהּ מוּתָּר, וְאִם עַד שֶׁלֹּא נִגְמַר דִּינָה עִיבְּרָה וּמִשֶּׁנִּגְמַר דִּינָה יָלְדָה – וְלָדָהּ אָסוּר. עוּבָּר יֶרֶךְ אִמּוֹ הוּא.
human_translation: Rather, Ravina says: say If before its verdict was finalized, was impregnated and calved, its offspring is permitted. If before its verdict was finalized, was impregnated and after its verdict was finalized it calved, its offspring is forbidden the fetus is its mother’s thigh,
llm_translation: Rather, Ravina said: I will say, if until her judgment was not completed she crossed over and gave birth - her child is permissible, but if until her judgment was not completed she crossed over and after her judgment was completed she gave birth - her child is forbidden. The fetus is considered as a thigh of its mother.

hebrew_text: כׇּל חַיָּיבֵי מִיתוֹת, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ מוּתְרֶה לְדָבָר חָמוּר – הָוֵי מוּתְרֶה לְדָבָר קַל.
human_translation: All liable to death Conclude from forewarned for a severe matter is forewarned for a lesser matter.
llm_translation: All those liable to death, if the more severe punishment is heard as permissible, it is permissible for the less severe punishment.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן? כְּגוֹן שֶׁהִתְרוּ בּוֹ סְתָם. וְהַאי תַּנָּא הוּא, דְּתַנְיָא: וּשְׁאָר חַיָּיבֵי מִיתוֹת שֶׁבְּתוֹרָה אֵין מְמִיתִין אוֹתָן אֶלָּא בְּעֵדָה וְעֵדִים וְהַתְרָאָה, וְעַד שֶׁיּוֹדִיעוּהוּ שֶׁהוּא חַיָּיב מִיתַת בֵּית דִּין. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: עַד שֶׁיּוֹדִיעוּהוּ בְּאֵיזֶה מִיתָה הוּא נֶהֱרָג.
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya says: With what are we dealing here? where forewarned without specification And is this tanna , as it is taught all the others, liable for death penalties in the Torah executes them only when The congregation, and witnesses, and forewarning And unless informed that he is liable the death penalty from court. Rabbi Yehuda says: unless informed by which death he is executed.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya said: What are we dealing with here? For example, they permitted him with a general ruling. And this Mishnah is as it was taught: And the rest of those liable to death penalties in the Torah are not put to death except by a court, witnesses, and warning, until they inform him that he is liable to the death penalty. Rabbi Yehuda says: Until they inform him of the specific death he is to be executed with.

hebrew_text: תַּנָּא קַמָּא יָלֵיף מִמְּקוֹשֵׁשׁ, וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: מְקוֹשֵׁשׁ הוֹרָאַת שָׁעָה הָיְתָה.
human_translation: The first tanna derived from wood gatherer Rabbi Yehuda says: wood gatherer was a provisional edict
llm_translation: The first Tanna derives from Mikosheish, and Rabbi Yehuda says: Mikosheish was a temporary teaching.

hebrew_text: הַנִּסְקָלִין בַּנִּשְׂרָפִין, מַתְנֵי לֵיהּ רַב יְחֶזְקֵאל לְרָמֵי בְּרֵיהּ: הַנִּשְׂרָפִין בַּנִּסְקָלִין, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: יִדּוֹנוּ בִּסְקִילָה, שֶׁהַשְּׂרֵיפָה חֲמוּרָה.
human_translation: who are stoned with who are burned, Rav Yeḥezkel taught to Rami, his son: who are burned with who are stoned, Rabbi Shimon says: They shall be sentenced by stoning, as burning is severe
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "If those who are stoned are then burned, Rav Yehezkel teaches his son: 'Those who are burned after being stoned,' Rabbi Shimon says: 'They should be judged by stoning, for burning is severe.'"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב יְהוּדָה: אַבָּא, לָא תַּיתְנְיֵיהּ הָכִי. מַאי אִירְיָא דִּשְׂרֵיפָה חֲמוּרָה? תִּיפּוֹק לֵיהּ דְּרוּבָּה נִסְקָלִין נִינְהוּ! אֶלָּא: הֵיכִי אַתְנְיֵיהּ?
human_translation: Rav Yehuda, said to him: Father, do not teach it that manner, Why specifically that burning is severe Derive that this the majority is liable to be stoned. Rather, how shall I teach it?
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Yehudah: Abba, do not give it like this. What is the matter of a severe burning? Let him go out, for they are stoning him in the public square! Rather, how should you give it?

hebrew_text: הַנִּסְקָלִין בַּנִּשְׂרָפִין, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: יִדּוֹנוּ בִּסְקִילָה, שֶׁהַשְּׂרֵיפָה חֲמוּרָה. אִי הָכִי, אֵימָא סֵיפָא: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: יִדּוֹנוּ בִּשְׂרֵיפָה, שֶׁהַסְּקִילָה חֲמוּרָה. תִּיפּוֹק לֵיהּ דְּרוּבָּה נִשְׂרָפִין נִינְהוּ!
human_translation: who are stoned with who are burned, Rabbi Shimon says: They shall be sentenced by stoning, as burning is severe If so, say the latter clause And the Rabbis say: They shall be sentenced by burning, as stoning is severe derive that this the majority is liable to be burned,
llm_translation: The stoners with the burners, Rabbi Shimon says: They shall be judged by stoning, for burning is severe. If so, say the latter part: And the sages say: They shall be judged by burning, for stoning is severe. Let the matter be resolved that they are burned!

hebrew_text: הָתָם, רַבָּנַן הוּא דְּקָאָמְרוּ לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: לְדִידָךְ דְּאָמְרַתְּ שְׂרֵיפָה חֲמוּרָה, לָא! סְקִילָה חֲמוּרָה.
human_translation: There, it is the Rabbis who say to Rabbi Shimon: According to you, who say burning is severe not stoning is severe
llm_translation: There, the sages, it is that they were saying to him to Rabbi Shimon: According to your opinion that you said burning is severe, no! Stoning is severe.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ שְׁמוּאֵל לְרַב יְהוּדָה: שִׁינָּנָא,
human_translation: Shmuel said to Rav Yehuda: Long-toothed one:
llm_translation: Said to him Shmuel to Rav Yehudah: Shinana,

hebrew_text: לָא תֵּימָא לֵיהּ לַאֲבוּךְ הָכִי, דְּתַנְיָא: הֲרֵי שֶׁהָיָה אָבִיו עוֹבֵר עַל דִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה, לֹא יֹאמַר לוֹ: ״אַבָּא, עָבַרְתָּ עַל דִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה״, אֶלָּא אוֹמֵר לוֹ: ״אַבָּא, כָּךְ כְּתִיב בַּתּוֹרָה״. סוֹף סוֹף הַיְינוּ הָךְ! אֶלָּא אוֹמֵר לוֹ: ״אַבָּא, מִקְרָא כָּתוּב בַּתּוֹרָה כָּךְ הוּא״.
human_translation: Do not speak to your father that as it is taught one’s father was violating Torah matters he should not say to him: Father, you violated Torah matters. Rather, he should say to him: Father, it is written so in the Torah. Ultimately, this that Rather, say to him: Father, a verse written in the Torah this is
llm_translation: Do not say to him, "To your father it was thus," as it is taught: If his father transgressed the words of the Torah, he should not say to him, "Father, you transgressed the words of the Torah," but rather he should say to him, "Father, this is how it is written in the Torah." Ultimately, this is the correct approach! Instead, he should say to him, "Father, the verse is written in the Torah like this."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מִי שֶׁנִּתְחַיֵּיב בִּשְׁתֵּי מִיתוֹת בֵּית דִּין – נִידּוֹן בַּחֲמוּרָה. עָבַר עֲבֵירָה שֶׁנִּתְחַיֵּיב שְׁתֵּי מִיתוֹת – נִידּוֹן בַּחֲמוּרָה. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: נִידּוֹן בַּזִּיקָּה הָרִאשׁוֹנָה שֶׁבָּאָה עָלָיו.
human_translation: One who is liable with two court death is sentenced to the severe violated transgression which he is liable two death he is sentenced to the severe Rabbi Yosei says: He is sentenced to the first relationship that came upon him,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who is liable to two death penalties by the court - is judged with severity. If one transgresses a sin for which he is liable to two death penalties - he is judged with severity. Rabbi Yosei says: He is judged based on the first punishment that comes upon him.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ פְּשִׁיטָא! אֶלָּא, אִיתְּגוֹרֵי אִיתְּגוּר?
human_translation: obvious? Rather, he would profit
llm_translation: Gemara: "G'ma peshita! Ella, ittegorei ittegur?"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: הָכִי בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן? כְּגוֹן שֶׁעָבַר עֲבֵירָה קַלָּה, וְנִגְמַר דִּינוֹ עַל עֲבֵירָה קַלָּה, וְחָזַר וְעָבַר עֲבֵירָה חֲמוּרָה. סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: כֵּיוָן דְּנִגְמַר דִּינוֹ לַעֲבֵירָה קַלָּה, הַאי גַּבְרָא קְטִילָא הוּא. קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: Rava says: With what are we dealing here? where he violated minor transgression and his verdict was issued for the minor transgression, and he then violated a major transgression enter your mind to say: Once his verdict was finalized for the minor transgression, this is a dead man, teaches us
llm_translation: Rava said: With what are we dealing? For example, one who committed a minor transgression, and his judgment was finalized for a minor transgression, and then he went and committed a severe transgression. Is it not logical to say: Once his judgment was finalized for a minor transgression, this person is considered a killer. This is evident to us.

hebrew_text: בְּעָא מִנֵּיהּ אֲבוּהּ דְּרַב יוֹסֵף בַּר חָמָא מֵרַבָּה בַּר נָתָן: מְנַָא הָא מִילְּתָא דַאֲמוּר רַבָּנַן, מִי שֶׁנִּתְחַיֵּיב שְׁתֵּי מִיתוֹת בֵּית דִּין נִידּוֹן בַּחֲמוּרָה? דִּכְתִיב: ״וְהוֹלִיד בֵּן פָּרִיץ שֹׁפֵךְ דָּם [וְגוֹ׳] אֶל הֶהָרִים אָכַל וְאֶת אֵשֶׁת רֵעֵהוּ טִמֵּא וְאֶל הַגִּלּוּלִים נָשָׂא עֵינָיו״.
human_translation: The father of Rav Yosef bar Ḥama asked of Rabba bar Natan: From where is this matter that the Sages stated One who is liable two court death is sentenced to severe as it is written: “And he begets a violent son, a shedder of blood, he has eaten upon the mountains and defiled his neighbor’s wife, and has lifted his eyes toward the idols,
llm_translation: The father of Rav Yosef bar Chama asked Rabba bar Nathan: "From where is this matter that the Sages say, 'One who is liable for two death penalties by the court is judged more severely?' As it is written: 'And he begot a son who is a rebel, a shedder of blood etc., who eats upon the mountains, defiles his neighbor's wife, and sets his eyes upon idols.'"

hebrew_text: ״וְהוֹלִיד בֵּן פָּרִיץ שֹׁפֵךְ דָּם״ – בְּסַיִיף, ״אֶת אֵשֶׁת רֵעֵהוּ טִמֵּא״ – זוֹ אֵשֶׁת אִישׁ בְּחֶנֶק, ״וְאֶל הַגִּלּוּלִים נָשָׂא עֵינָיו״ – זוֹ עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה בִּסְקִילָה. וּכְתִיב: ״מוֹת יוּמָת דָּמָיו בּוֹ יִהְיֶה״ – בִּסְקִילָה.
human_translation: “And he begets a violent son, a shedder of blood,” with a sword; “defiled his neighbor’s wife,” this is a married woman, by strangulation; “lifted his eyes toward the idols,” this is idol worship, by stoning. And it is written “He shall be put to death, his blood shall be upon himself” by stoning.
llm_translation: "And he begot a son who is a rebel, a shedder of blood" - with a sword, "He defiled his neighbor's wife" - this refers to a married woman through strangulation, "And he raised his eyes to the idols" - this is foreign worship through stoning. And it is written: "His blood shall be upon him" - through stoning.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: אֵימָא כּוּלְּהוּ בִּסְקִילָה. ״וְהוֹלִיד בֵּן פָּרִיץ שֹׁפֵךְ דָּם״ – זֶה בֵּן סוֹרֵר וּמוֹרֶה דְּבִסְקִילָה, ״אֵשֶׁת רֵעֵהוּ טִמֵּא״ – זוֹ נַעֲרָה הַמְאוֹרָסָה דְּבִסְקִילָה, ״וְאֶל הַגִּלּוּלִים נָשָׂא עֵינָיו״ – זוֹ עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה דְּבִסְקִילָה.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak objects to this: Say that all of by stoning. “And he begets a violent son, a shedder of blood,” this is a wayward and rebellious son, who by stoning; “defiled his neighbor’s wife,” this is a betrothed young woman, which by stoning; “lifted his eyes toward the idols,” this is idol worship, which by stoning.
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak objects to her: Say all of them are liable to stoning. "And he begot a stubborn and rebellious son, who does not hearken to the voice of his father or the voice of his mother" - this refers to a rebellious and defiant son who is liable to stoning.
