"The wife of his neighbor he has defiled" - this refers to a betrothed maiden who is liable to stoning. "And he has lifted up his eyes to idols" - this refers to idol worship which is liable to stoning.

hebrew_text: אִם כֵּן, מַאי קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן יְחֶזְקֵאל? דִּלְמָא תּוֹרָה קָא מַהְדַּר. אִם כֵּן, אִיבְּעִי לֵיהּ לְאַהְדּוֹרַהּ כִּי הֵיכִי דְּאַהְדְּרַהּ מֹשֶׁה רַבֵּינוּ.
human_translation: If so, what is Ezekiel teaching us? Perhaps Torah is reiterating, If so it have been necessary for him to reiterate in the manner that Moses our teacher reviewed it,
llm_translation: If so, what does it imply to us from Ezekiel? Perhaps it is referring to the Torah. If so, let him ask to renew it, so that it will be renewed as our teacher Moses did.

hebrew_text: דָּרֵשׁ רַב אַחָא בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: מַאי דִּכְתִיב ״אֶל הֶהָרִים לֹא אָכָל״? שֶׁלֹּא אָכַל בִּזְכוּת אֲבוֹתָיו. ״וְעֵינָיו לֹא נָשָׂא אֶל גִּלּוּלֵי בֵּית יִשְׂרָאֵל״? שֶׁלֹּא הָלַךְ בְּקוֹמָה זְקוּפָה.
human_translation: Rav Aḥa, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, taught: What which is written: “He did not eat upon the mountains” he did not eat due to the merit of his fathers; “Nor did he lift his eyes toward the idols of the house of Israel” that he did not walk with upright stature,
llm_translation: Rav Acha, son of Rabbi Chanina, expounded: What is the meaning of the verse, "To the mountains he did not eat"? That he did not eat through the merit of his forefathers. "And his eyes did not turn to the idols of the house of Israel"? That he did not walk in an erect posture.

hebrew_text: ״וְאֶת אֵשֶׁת רֵעֵהוּ לֹא טִמֵּא״ – שֶׁלֹּא יָרַד לְאוּמָּנוּת חֲבֵירוֹ, ״וְאֶל אִשָּׁה נִדָּה לֹא יִקְרָב״ – שֶׁלֹּא נֶהֱנָה מִקּוּפָּה שֶׁל צְדָקָה. וּכְתִיב: ״צַדִּיק הוּא חָיֹה יִחְיֶה״. כְּשֶׁהָיָה רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל מַגִּיעַ לְמִקְרָא הַזֶּה, הָיָה בּוֹכֶה. אֲמַר: מַאן דְּעָבֵיד לְכוּלְּהוּ הוּא דְּחָיֵי, בַּחֲדָא מִינַּיְיהוּ – לָא?
human_translation: “Nor did he defile his neighbor’s wife” that he did not infringe upon another’s trade, “Nor did he approach a menstruating woman” that he did not benefit from charity fund And it is written “He is a righteous man, he shall live” When Rabban Gamliel would reach this verse: he would cry and say: It is one who performs all of them, who lives; one of them, no,
llm_translation: "And the wife of his neighbor he shall not defile" - that he should not descend to the craft of his fellow. "And to a woman in her impurity he shall not come near" - that he should not benefit from the basket of charity. And it is written: "The righteous shall live by his faith." When Rabban Gamliel reached this verse, he would cry. He said: Who engages in all of these, he will live, but if one of them is missing - will he not?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה: ״אַל תִּטַּמְּאוּ בְּכׇל אֵלֶּה״, הָכִי נָמֵי בְּכוּלְּהוּ – אִין, בַּחֲדָא מִינַּיְיהוּ – לָא? אֶלָּא: בְּאַחַת מִכׇּל אֵלֶּה, הָכִי נָמֵי: בְּאַחַת מִכׇּל אֵלֶּה.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva said to If that is so, “Do not become defiled with all of these” too, in all of yes, in one of them, no, Rather, in one of all these; too, in one of all these
llm_translation: He said to him Rabbi Akiva, rather from now on: "Do not defile yourselves with all these," thus it is said in all of them - no, in one of them - not? Rather, with one of all these, thus it is said: with one of all these.

hebrew_text: עָבַר עֲבֵירָה. תַּנְיָא: כֵּיצַד אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי? נִידּוֹן בְּזִיקָּה רִאשׁוֹנָה הַבָּאָה עָלָיו. חֲמוֹתוֹ וְנַעֲשֵׂית אֵשֶׁת אִישׁ – נִידּוֹן בַּחֲמוֹתוֹ. אֵשֶׁת אִישׁ וְנַעֲשֵׂית חֲמוֹתוֹ – נִידּוֹן בְּאֵשֶׁת אִישׁ.
human_translation: violated transgression It is taught How, Rabbi Yosei say sentenced to the first relationship that came upon him? his mother-in-law, and she became a married woman he is sentenced with his mother-in-law. a married woman, and she became his mother-in-law, he is sentenced with a married woman.
llm_translation: He transgressed a sin. It was taught: How did Rabbi Yosei say? He is judged by the first connection that comes upon him. His mother-in-law and she becomes the wife of a man - he is judged by his mother-in-law. The wife of a man and she becomes his mother-in-law - he is judged by the wife of a man.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה לְרָבָא: חֲמוֹתוֹ וְנַעֲשֵׂית אֵשֶׁת אִישׁ, נִידּוֹן בַּחֲמוֹתוֹ?
human_translation: Rav Adda bar Ahava said to Rava: his mother-in-law, and she became a married woman is he sentenced with his mother-in-law?
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Adda bar Ahava to Rava: His mother-in-law and she becomes the wife of a man, is she judged by her mother-in-law?

hebrew_text: לִידּוֹן נָמֵי אַאִיסּוּר אֵשֶׁת אִישׁ! דְּהָא אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: מוֹדֶה רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּאִיסּוּר מוֹסִיף.
human_translation: Let him be sentenced for the prohibition of a married woman as well, as Rabbi Abbahu says: Rabbi Yosei concedes in an expanded prohibition.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates to: "Lidon namei a'isur eishet ish! Deha amar Rabbi Avahu: Modeh Rabbi Yosei be'isur mosif."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַדָּא בְּרִי, בִּתְרֵי קְטָלֵי קָטְלַתְּ לֵיהּ?
human_translation: said to him: Adda my son, you kill him with two death penalties?
llm_translation: He said to him: "Adah Bari, between two killings have you killed him?"

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מִי שֶׁלָּקָה וְשָׁנָה, בֵּית דִּין מַכְנִיסִין אוֹתוֹ לַכִּיפָּה, וּמַאֲכִילִין אוֹתוֹ שְׂעוֹרִין עַד שֶׁכְּרֵיסוֹ מִתְבַּקַּעַת.
human_translation: One who was flogged and repeated court places him into the vaulted chamber [ lakippa ] and feeds him barley until his belly ruptures
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who was bitten by a mad dog and changed, the court brings him into the chamber, and they feed him barley until his belly bursts.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מִשּׁוּם דְּלָקָה וְשָׁנָה, בֵּית דִּין כּוֹנְסִין אוֹתוֹ לַכִּיפָּה? אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ: הָכָא בְּמַלְקִיּוֹת שֶׁל כָּרֵיתוֹת עָסְקִינַן, דְּגַבְרָא בַּר קְטָלָא הוּא, וְקָרוֹבֵי הוּא דְּלָא מְיקָרַב קְטָלֵיהּ. וְכֵיוָן דְּקָא מְוַותַּר לַהּ לְנַפְשֵׁיהּ, מְקָרְבִינַן לֵיהּ לִקְטָלֵיהּ עִילָּוֵיהּ.
human_translation: Due to that he was flogged and repeated court place him into the vaulted chamber Rabbi Yirmeya says Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish says: Here, we are dealing with lashes by excision from the World-to-Come [ karet ]. As the man is liable to death but his death is not advanced And since he surrenders his life we advance his execution upon him
llm_translation: Gemara: Because he lit and repeated, does the court gather him for stoning? Rabbi Yirmiyah said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish: Here we are dealing with the floggings of Karaites, for he is a man of violent temper, and his relatives are close to him so that they do not come close to kill him. And since he is permitted to save himself, we bring him close to kill him with his own consent.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב לְרַבִּי יִרְמְיָה בַּר תַּחְלִיפָא: תָּא אַסְבְּרָא לָךְ, בְּמַלְקִיּוֹת שֶׁל כָּרֵת אַחַת, אֲבָל שֶׁל שְׁתַּיִם וְשֶׁל שָׁלֹשׁ כָּרֵיתוֹת – אִיסּוּרֵי הוּא דְּקָא טָעֵים, וְלָא מְוַותַּר כּוּלֵּי הַאי.
human_translation: Rabbi Ya’akov said to Rabbi Yirmeya bar Taḥlifa: Come and I will explain to you with lashes for one karet But for two or for three karet , he is tasting prohibition and he is not surrendering to that extent.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rabbi Yaakov to Rabbi Yirmeya bar Tachlifa: Come, I will explain to you, with regards to the lashes of one Karait, but with regards to two and three Karait lashes – they are considered prohibitions, and not permitted at all.

hebrew_text: מִי שֶׁלָּקָה וְשָׁנָה. שָׁנָה אַף עַל גַּב דְּלָא שִׁילֵּשׁ. לֵימָא מַתְנִיתִין דְּלָא כְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל? דְּאִי רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, הָא אָמַר: עַד תְּלָת זִימְנֵי לָא הָוְיָא חֲזָקָה.
human_translation: One who was flogged and repeated he repeated even if he did not repeat a third Let us say the mishna is not in accordance with Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, as if Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, doesn’t he say: Presumptive status is not until three times?
llm_translation: One who received lashes and repeated the offense. He repeated it even though he did not desist. Let us say the Mishnah that it is not like Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel? For if it were Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, did he not say: Until three times, it is not considered a habitual act.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבִינָא: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, קָסָבַר עֲבֵירוֹת מַחֲזִיקוֹת.
human_translation: Ravina says: Even you say Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, holds transgressions, establish presumptive status
llm_translation: Ravina said: Even if you say it is Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, he holds that transgressions are effective.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: עָבַר עֲבֵירָה שֶׁיֵּשׁ בָּהּ מַלְקוֹת, פַּעַם רִאשׁוֹנָה וּשְׁנִיָּה מַלְקִין אוֹתוֹ, וּשְׁלִישִׁית כּוֹנְסִין אוֹתוֹ לַכִּיפָּה. אַבָּא שָׁאוּל אוֹמֵר: אַף בַּשְּׁלִישִׁית מַלְקִין אוֹתוֹ, בָּרְבִיעִית כּוֹנְסִין אוֹתוֹ לַכִּיפָּה. מַאי לָאו דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא מַלְקִיּוֹת מַחְזִיקוֹת, וּבִפְלוּגְתָּא דְּרַבִּי וְרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל קָמִיפַּלְגִי?
human_translation: raises an objection one performed a transgression that has lashes first and the second time, flogs him; and third places him in the vaulted chamber. Abba Shaul says: Even the third flogs him; fourth places him in the vaulted chamber. What, is it not that everyone lashes establish presumptive status and concerning the dispute of Rabbi and Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, disagree?
llm_translation: Challenger: One who commits a transgression that incurs lashes, the first and second time they administer lashes to him, and the third time they gather him to the platform. Abba Shaul says: Even on the third time they administer lashes to him, on the fourth time they gather him to the platform. What is the reason that the majority of the world hold that lashes are sufficient, and in the dispute between Rabbi and Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, they diverge?

hebrew_text: לָא, דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא אִית לְהוּ דְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, וְהָכָא בְּהָא קָא מִיפַּלְגִי: דְּמָר סָבַר עֲבֵירוֹת מַחְזִיקוֹת, וּמָר סָבַר מַלְקִיּוֹת מַחְזִיקוֹת.
human_translation: No, everyone, agrees with of Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel and here it is with regard to this that they disagree: That Sage, holds: Transgressions establish presumptive status and Sage, Abba Shaul, holds: Lashes establish presumptive status
llm_translation: Not, for all the world has to it Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, and here in this case he argues: for Master holds transgressions that are habitual, and Master holds lashes that are habitual.

hebrew_text: וְהָדְתַנְיָא: הִתְרוּ בּוֹ וְשָׁתַק, הִתְרוּ בּוֹ וְהִרְכִּין רֹאשׁוֹ – פַּעַם רִאשׁוֹנָה וּשְׁנִיָּה מַתְרִין בּוֹ, שְׁלִישִׁית – כּוֹנְסִין אוֹתוֹ לַכִּיפָּה. אַבָּא שָׁאוּל אוֹמֵר: אַף בַּשְּׁלִישִׁית מַתְרִין בּוֹ, בִּרְבִיעִית – כּוֹנְסִין אוֹתוֹ לַכִּיפָּה.
human_translation: And that which is taught forewarned him and he was silent forewarned him and he bowed his head first and second time they forewarn him a third places him in the vaulted chamber. Abba Shaul says: Even the third forewarn him and the fourth places him in the vaulted chamber.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If he permitted it and remained silent, if he permitted it and nodded his head - the first and second times they permit him, the third time they gather him to the basket. Abba Saul says: Even the third time they permit him, the fourth time they gather him to the basket.

hebrew_text: וְהָתָם, מַלְקוֹת לֵיכָּא. בְּמַאי קָמִיפַּלְגִי? אָמַר רָבִינָא: בְּכִיפָּה צְרִיכָה הַתְרָאָה קָמִיפַּלְגִי.
human_translation: And there, there are no lashes, with regard to what do they disagree? Ravina says: with regard to a vaulted chamber requires forewarning they disagree.
llm_translation: And there, lashes are not applicable. With what are they disagreeing? Rabinah said: They are disagreeing regarding a kippah, which requires prior warning.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי כִּיפָּה? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: מְלֹא קוֹמָתוֹ. וְהֵיכָא רְמִיזָא? אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: ״תְּמוֹתֵת רָשָׁע רָעָה״.
human_translation: And what vaulted chamber? Rav Yehuda says: the full height of And where intimated? Reish Lakish said “Evil shall kill the wicked”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "U'mai kippah? Amar Rav Yehudah: melo komato. V'heicha remeiza? Amar Reish Lakish: 'temotet rasha ra'ah.'" English translation: "And what is a kippah? Rav Yehudah said: the height of his stature. And where is the allusion? Reish Lakish said: 'The wicked shall perish.'"

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: מַאי דִּכְתִיב ״כִּי [גַּם] לֹא יֵדַע הָאָדָם אֶת עִתּוֹ כַּדָּגִים שֶׁנֶּאֱחָזִים בִּמְצוֹדָה רָעָה״? מַאי ״מְצוֹדָה רָעָה״? אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: חַכָּה.
human_translation: And Reish Lakish says: What which is written: “For man also knows not his time, like fish snared in an evil net” What evil net? Reish Lakish says: a hook;
llm_translation: And Reish Lakish said: What is the meaning of what is written, "For man also does not know his time, like fish that are caught in an evil net"? What is the meaning of "evil net"? Reish Lakish said: A snare.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַהוֹרֵג נֶפֶשׁ שֶׁלֹּא בְּעֵדִים, מַכְנִיסִין אוֹתוֹ לַכִּיפָּה וּמַאֲכִילִין אוֹתוֹ לֶחֶם צָר וּמַיִם לָחַץ.
human_translation: one who kills a person not in witnesses places him into a vaulted chamber and feeds him sparing bread and scant water
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who kills a person without witnesses, they bring him to the beit din for judgment, and they feed him bread of affliction and water of oppression.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מְנָא יָדְעִינַן? אָמַר רַב: בְּעֵדוּת מְיוּחֶדֶת. וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: שֶׁלֹּא בְּהַתְרָאָה.
human_translation: from where do we know Rav says: about disjointed testimony, And Shmuel says: where no forewarning,
llm_translation: Gemara: How do we know? Rav said: Through unique testimony. And Shmuel said: Not through vision.

hebrew_text: וְרַב חִסְדָּא אָמַר אֲבִימִי: כְּגוֹן דְּאִיתַּכְחוּשׁ בִּבְדִיקוֹת וְלָא אִיתַּכְחוּשׁ בַּחֲקִירוֹת, כְּדִתְנַן: מַעֲשֶׂה וּבָדַק בֶּן זַכַּאי בְּעוּקְצֵי תְאֵנִים.
human_translation: And Rav Ḥisda Avimi says: where contradicted in the examinations but did not contradict in the interrogations, As we learned an incident and ben Zakkai examined with regard to the stems of figs
llm_translation: And Rav Ḥisda said in the name of Avimi: For example, where they were diligent in inspections but not diligent in investigations, as we learned: There was an incident where Ben Zakkai inspected fig cakes.

hebrew_text: וּמַאֲכִילִין אוֹתוֹ לֶחֶם צָר וּמַיִם לָחַץ. מַאי שְׁנָא הָכָא דְּקָתָנֵי: נוֹתְנִין לוֹ לֶחֶם צָר וּמַיִם לָחַץ, וּמַאי שְׁנָא הָתָם דְּקָתָנֵי: מַאֲכִילִין אוֹתוֹ שְׂעוֹרִין עַד שֶׁכְּרֵיסוֹ מִתְבַּקַּעַת? אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי נוֹתְנִין לוֹ לֶחֶם צָר וּמַיִם לָחַץ עַד שֶׁיּוּקְטַן מַעְיָינוֹ, וַהֲדַר מַאֲכִילִין אוֹתוֹ שְׂעוֹרִין עַד שֶׁכְּרֵיסוֹ מִתְבַּקַּעַת.
human_translation: And feeds him sparing bread and scant water. What is different here that teaches gives him sparing bread and scant water and what is different there that teaches feeds him barley until his belly ruptures; Rav Sheshet says: this and that gives him sparing bread and scant water until his intestines contract and then feeds him barley until his belly ruptures.
llm_translation: And we feed him bread of affliction and water of oppression. What is the difference here that it teaches: we give him bread of affliction and water of oppression, and what is the difference there that it teaches: we feed him barley until his stomach contracts? Rav Sheshet said: both here and there we give him bread of affliction and water of oppression until his stomach shrinks, and then we feed him barley until his stomach expands.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַגּוֹנֵב אֶת הַקַּסְוָה, וְהַמְקַלֵּל בְּקוֹסֵם, וְהַבּוֹעֵל אֲרַמִּית – קַנָּאִין פּוֹגְעִין בּוֹ. כֹּהֵן שֶׁשִּׁמֵּשׁ בְּטוּמְאָה – אֵין אֶחָיו הַכֹּהֲנִים מְבִיאִין אוֹתוֹ לְבֵית דִּין, אֶלָּא פִּרְחֵי כְהוּנָּה מוֹצִיאִין אוֹתוֹ חוּץ לָעֲזָרָה וּמְפַצְיעִין אֶת מוֹחוֹ בִּגְזִירִין. זָר שֶׁשִּׁמֵּשׁ בַּמִּקְדָּשׁ – רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: בְּחֶנֶק, וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: בִּידֵי שָׁמַיִם.
human_translation: one who steals a kasva , and one who curses with a sorcerer, and one who engages in intercourse with an Aramean woman, zealots strike him a priest who performed service in ritual impurity, his priestly brethren do not bring him to court rather, the young men of the priesthood remove him from the Temple courtyard and pierce his skull with pieces of wood. a non-priest who performed the service in the Temple, Rabbi Akiva says: by strangulation, and the Rabbis say: at the hand of Heaven.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who steals a purse, and one who curses using an idol, and one who cohabits with an Aramean woman - zealots may attack him. A priest who served in a state of impurity - his priestly brethren do not bring him to the court, but the young priests of his division take him out to the Temple courtyard and split his brain with axes. A non-priest who served in the Temple - Rabbi Akiva says: by strangulation, and the Sages say: by the hands of Heaven.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי קַסְוָה? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: כְּלִי שָׁרֵת. וְכֵן הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״וְאֶת קְשׂוֹת הַנָּסֶךְ״. וְהֵיכָא רְמִיזָא? ״וְלֹא יָבֹאוּ לִרְאוֹת כְּבַלַּע אֶת הַקֹּדֶשׁ וָמֵתוּ״.
human_translation: What kasva Rav Yehuda says: service vessel And likewise, it is stated: “And the jars [ kesot ] with which to pour libations” And where is it intimated “But they shall not come to see the sacred items as they are being covered [ kevala ], lest they die”
llm_translation: Gemara: What is "kasvah"? Rav Yehudah said: A service vessel. And similarly, it says: "And the pitchers of the drink offering." And where is the allusion? "So that they may not come to see the holy things as they are being swallowed and die."

hebrew_text: וְהַמְקַלֵּל בְּקוֹסֵם. תָּנֵי רַב יוֹסֵף: יַכֶּה קוֹסֵם אֶת קוֹסְמוֹ. רַבָּנַן, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַבָּה בַּר מָרִי, אָמְרִי: יַכֵּהוּ קוֹסֵם לוֹ וּלְקוֹנוֹ וּלְמַקְנוֹ.
human_translation: And one who curses with a sorcerer Rav Yosef teaches Let the sorcerer strike his sorcerer, The Rabbis, and some say Rabba, son of Mari, say Let the sorcerer strike him, and his Creator and his Provider.
llm_translation: The one who curses with a sorcerer. It was taught: Rav Yosef said: Let the sorcerer strike his fellow sorcerer. The Rabbis, and some say Rabba bar Mari, said: Let the sorcerer strike him for himself, his buyer, and his owner.

hebrew_text: וְהַבּוֹעֵל אֲרַמִּית, בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ רַב כָּהֲנָא מֵרַב:
human_translation: one who engages in intercourse with an Aramean woman Rav Kahana asked of Rav:
llm_translation: And one who cohabits with an Aramaic woman, Rav Kahana inquired of Rav regarding his status.

hebrew_text: לֹא פָּגְעוּ בּוֹ קַנָּאִין, מַהוּ? אִינַּשְׁיֵיהּ רַב לִגְמָרֵיהּ. אַקְרְיוּהּ לְרַב כָּהֲנָא בְּחֶלְמֵיהּ: ״בָּגְדָה יְהוּדָה וְתוֹעֵבָה נֶעֶשְׂתָה בְיִשְׂרָאֵל וּבִירוּשָׁלִָים כִּי חִלֵּל יְהוּדָה קֹדֶשׁ ה׳ אֲשֶׁר אָהֵב וּבָעַל בַּת אֵל נֵכָר״. אֲתָא אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָכִי אַקְרְיוּן.
human_translation: If zealots did not strike him, what is Rav forgot tradition They read to Rav Kahana in his dream: “Judah has dealt treacherously and an abomination is committed in Israel and in Jerusalem, as Judah has profaned the sacred of the Lord, which he loves, and has engaged in intercourse with the daughter of a strange god” came and said This is what they read to me
llm_translation: They did not meet him, the zealots, what? His men, Rav to finish. They read it to Rav Kahana in his dream: "Judah has dealt treacherously, and an abomination has been committed in Israel and in Jerusalem, for Judah has profaned the holy place of the Lord which He loves, and has married the daughter of a foreign god." He came and said to him: So they read it.

hebrew_text: אִדַּכְרֵיהּ רַב לִגְמָרֵיהּ. ״בָּגְדָה יְהוּדָה״ – זוֹ עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה, וְכֵן הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״כֵּן בְּגַדְתֶּם בִּי בֵּית יִשְׂרָאֵל נְאֻם ה׳״. ״וְתוֹעֵבָה נֶעֶשְׂתָה בְיִשְׂרָאֵל וּבִירוּשָׁלִָים״ – זֶה מִשְׁכַּב זְכוּר, וְכֵן הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״וְאֶת זָכָר לֹא תִשְׁכַּב מִשְׁכְּבֵי אִשָּׁה תּוֹעֵבָה הִיא״. ״כִּי חִלֵּל יְהוּדָה קֹדֶשׁ ה׳״ – זוֹ זוֹנָה, וְכֵן הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״לֹא תִּהְיֶה קְדֵשָׁה מִבְּנוֹת יִשְׂרָאֵל״. ״וּבָעַל בַּת אֵל נֵכָר״ – זֶה הַבָּא עַל הַגּוֹיָה.
human_translation: Rav remembered tradition “Judah has dealt treacherously,” this idol worship. And likewise it says: you have dealt treacherously with Me, house of Israel, says the Lord “And an abomination is committed in Israel and in Jerusalem,” this male homosexual intercourse, and likewise it says: “You shall not lie with a man as one lies with a woman; it is an abomination” “As Judah has profaned the sacred [ kodesh ] of the Lord,” this a prostitute, and likewise it says: “There shall be no harlot [ kedesha ] of the daughters of Israel” “And has engaged in intercourse with the daughter of a strange god,” this one who engages in intercourse with a gentile woman.
llm_translation: He remembered it, Rav completed it. "Bagdah Yehudah" - this is idol worship, as it says: "So you have been unfaithful to Me, O house of Israel, declares the Lord." "And abomination has been committed in Israel and in Jerusalem" - this is male homosexuality, as it says: "You shall not lie with a male as with a woman; it is an abomination." "For Judah has profaned the sanctuary of the Lord" - this is prostitution, as it says: "There shall be no cult prostitute of the daughters of Israel." "And he marries a daughter of a foreign god" - this is one who marries a non-Jewish woman.

hebrew_text: וּכְתִיב בָּתְרֵיהּ: ״יַכְרֵת ה׳ לָאִישׁ אֲשֶׁר יַעֲשֶׂנָּה עֵר וְעֹנֶה מֵאׇהֳלֵי יַעֲקֹב וּמַגִּישׁ מִנְחָה לַה׳ צְבָאוֹת״. אִם תַּלְמִיד חָכָם הוּא – לֹא יִהְיֶה לוֹ עֵר בַּחֲכָמִים וְעוֹנֶה בַּתַּלְמִידִים. אִם כֹּהֵן הוּא – לֹא יִהְיֶה לוֹ בֵּן מַגִּישׁ מִנְחָה לַה׳ צְבָאוֹת.
human_translation: And it is written thereafter “May the Lord excise the man who does this, who calls and who answers from the tents of Jacob, and he who sacrifices a meal-offering to the Lord of hosts” If he is a Torah scholar, he will have neither one who calls among the Sages, nor one who answers among the students, If he is a priest, he will not have a son who sacrifices a meal-offering to the Lord of hosts.
llm_translation: And it is written after it: "Let the Lord cut off from the man that doeth this, him that waketh and him that answereth, out of the tents of Jacob, and him that offereth an offering unto the Lord of hosts." If he is a scholar, he shall not have a wake among the wise and an answerer among the students. If he is a priest, he shall not have a son who offers an offering unto the Lord of hosts.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אֲבוּיָה: כׇּל הַבָּא עַל הַגּוֹיָה, כְּאִילּוּ מִתְחַתֵּן בַּעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״וּבָעַל בַּת אֵל נֵכָר״. וְכִי בַּת יֵשׁ לוֹ לְאֵל נֵכָר? אֶלָּא זֶה הַבָּא עַל הַגּוֹיָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Avuya says: anyone who engages in intercourse with a gentile woman it is as though he married idol worship as it is written: “And has engaged in intercourse with the daughter of a strange god.” Does a strange god have a daughter? Rather, this one who engages in intercourse with a gentile woman
llm_translation: Rabbi Chiya bar Avuya said: Anyone who marries a gentile woman, it is as if he has engaged in idol worship, as it is written: "And he marries the daughter of a foreign god." But does God have a daughter who is foreign? Rather, this refers to one who marries a gentile woman.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אֲבוּיָה: כָּתוּב עַל גֻּלְגׇּלְתּוֹ שֶׁל יְהוֹיָקִים ״זֹאת וְעוֹד אַחֶרֶת״. זְקֵינוֹ דְּרַבִּי פְּרִידָא אַשְׁכַּח הָהוּא גּוּלְגֻּלְתָּא דַּהֲוָת שַׁדְיָא בְּשַׁעֲרֵי יְרוּשָׁלַיִם, וַהֲוָה כָּתוּב עִילָּוַיהּ ״זֹאת וְעוֹד אַחֶרֶת״. קַבְרַהּ וַהֲדַר נְבוּג, קַבְרַהּ וַהֲדַר נְבוּג. אֲמַר: הַאי גּוּלְגֻּלְתָּא דִּיהוֹיָקִים, דִּכְתִיב בֵּיהּ ״קְבוּרַת חֲמוֹר יִקָּבֵר סָחוֹב וְהַשְׁלֵךְ מֵהָלְאָה לְשַׁעֲרֵי יְרוּשָׁלִָים״.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Avuya says: written on the skull of Jehoiakim This and yet another, The grandfather of Rabbi Perida, found a skull that was cast at the gates of Jerusalem, and upon it was written: This and yet another. He buried it, and it then emerged [ navug ] He buried it and it then emerged He said: This is the skull of Jehoiakim, as it is written in his regard: “With the burial of a donkey he shall be buried, drawn and cast beyond the gates of Jerusalem”
llm_translation: And Rabbi Chiya bar Avuya said: It is written on the skull of Yehoyakim, "This and another." The elders of Rabbi Perida found that skull that was lying in the gates of Jerusalem, and it was written on it, "This and another." It was buried and then it was exhumed, buried and then exhumed. He said: This skull of Yehoyakim, as it is written in it, "The burial of a donkey shall be buried, dragged and cast out beyond the gates of Jerusalem."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר: מַלְכָּא הוּא, וְלָאו אוֹרַח אַרְעָא לְבַזּוֹיֵי. שַׁקְלַהּ, כַּרְכַהּ בְּשִׁירָאֵי, וְאוֹתְבַיהּ בְּסִיפְטָא. אֲתַאי דְּבֵיתְהוּ, חֲזֵיתַהּ. נְפַקַת, אֲמַרָה לְהוּ לְשִׁיבָבָתַהָא. אָמְרִי לַהּ: הַאי דְּאִיתְּתָא קַמַּיְיתָא הִיא, דְּלָא קָא מִנְּשֵׁי לַהּ. שְׁגַרְתַּא לְתַנּוּרָא וְקַלְתַהּ. כִּי אֲתָא, אֲמַר: הַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב עִילָּוַיהּ: ״זֹאת וְעוֹד אַחֶרֶת״.
human_translation: said: He is a king and not proper conduct to treat him contemptuously. He took wrapped it in silk [ beshira’ei ] and placed it in a chest [ besifta ]. His wife came saw went out told her neighbors said to her: This is the skull of the first wife as he has not forgotten her she kindled the oven and burned When came he said: That is which is written about him: This and yet another.
llm_translation: He said: it is the king, and not the way of the land to disgrace him. He took her, wrapped her in silk, and placed her in a chest. When he came to his house, he saw her. She went out, and said to her captors. They said to her: this one that you are standing before is not worthy of you. They sent her to the oven and burned her. When he came, he said: this is what is written about her: "This and another."

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא רַב דִּימִי אָמַר: בֵּית דִּינוֹ שֶׁל חַשְׁמוֹנַאי גָּזְרוּ, הַבָּא עַל הַגּוֹיָה חַיָּיב עָלֶיהָ מִשּׁוּם נִדָּה, שִׁפְחָה, גּוֹיָה, אֵשֶׁת אִישׁ.
human_translation: When Rav Dimi came he said: The court of the Hasmoneans issued a decree who engages in intercourse with a gentile woman is liable due to a menstruating woman [ nidda ] maidservant [ shifḥa ], a gentile woman [ goya ] a married woman [ eshet ish ].
llm_translation: When Rav Dimi came, he said: The court of the Hasmoneans decreed that one who engages in relations with a non-Jewish woman is liable on account of niddah, maidservant, non-Jewish woman, and a married woman.

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא רָבִין אָמַר: מִשּׁוּם נשג״ז – נִדָּה, שִׁפְחָה, גּוֹיָה, זוֹנָה. אֲבָל מִשּׁוּם אִישׁוּת לֵית לְהוּ. וְאִידַּךְ: נְשַׁיְיהוּ וַדַּאי לָא מַפְקְרִי.
human_translation: When Ravin came he said: due to Nun , shin , gimmel , zayin . a menstruating woman, a maidservant, a gentile woman. a zona . But not due to matrimony, And the other certainly do not forsake their wives;
llm_translation: When Ravin came, he said: Because of nashg"z - niddah, shifcha, goyah, zona. But because of ishut, they do not have. And the other opinion: Their wives are certainly not divorced.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: הַבָּא לִימָּלֵךְ, אֵין מוֹרִין לוֹ. אִיתְּמַר נָמֵי, אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הַבָּא לִימָּלֵךְ, אֵין מוֹרִין לוֹ.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda says: one who comes to consult does not instruct him It was also stated Rabba bar bar Ḥana says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: one who comes to consult does not instruct him
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: One who comes to be circumcised, we do not delay for him. It was stated similarly: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: One who comes to be circumcised, we do not delay for him.

hebrew_text: וְלֹא עוֹד, אֶלָּא שֶׁאִם פֵּירַשׁ זִמְרִי וַהֲרָגוֹ פִּנְחָס – נֶהֱרָג עָלָיו. נֶהְפַּךְ זִמְרִי וַהֲרָגוֹ לְפִנְחָס – אֵין נֶהֱרָג עָלָיו, שֶׁהֲרֵי רוֹדֵף הוּא.
human_translation: Moreover, if Zimri had separated and Pinehas killed him, have been executed for him, Zimri would have turned and killed Pinehas not have been executed for him, as was a pursuer.
llm_translation: And not only that, but if he separated Zimri and killed him, Pinchas - he is killed upon him. If Zimri turned into Pinchas and killed him - he is not killed upon him, for he is a pursuer.

hebrew_text: ״וַיֹּאמֶר מֹשֶׁה אֶל שֹׁפְטֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל וְגוֹ׳״. הָלַךְ שִׁבְטוֹ שֶׁל שִׁמְעוֹן אֵצֶל זִמְרִי בֶּן סָלוּא, אָמְרוּ לוֹ: הֵן דָּנִין דִּינֵי נְפָשׁוֹת וְאַתָּה יוֹשֵׁב וְשׁוֹתֵק?! מָה עָשָׂה? עָמַד וְקִיבֵּץ עֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבָּעָה אֶלֶף מִיִּשְׂרָאֵל וְהָלַךְ אֵצֶל כׇּזְבִּי. אֲמַר לַהּ: הִשָּׁמֵיעִי לִי. אָמְרָה לוֹ: בַּת מֶלֶךְ אֲנִי, וְכֵן צִוָּה לִי אָבִי: לֹא תִּשָּׁמְעִי אֶלָּא לַגָּדוֹל שֶׁבָּהֶם. אֲמַר לַהּ: אַף הוּא נְשִׂיא שֵׁבֶט הוּא, וְלָא עוֹד אֶלָּא שֶׁהוּא גָּדוֹל מִמֶּנּוּ, שֶׁהוּא שֵׁנִי לַבֶּטֶן וְהוּא שְׁלִישִׁי לַבֶּטֶן.
human_translation: “And Moses said to the judges of Israel: The tribe of Simeon went to Zimri, son of Salu, said to him: They are judging capital law and you are sitting and are silent? What did do? He arose and gathered twenty-four thousand from Israel, and went to Cozbi, said to her: Submit to me She said to him: I am the daughter of a king, and this my father commanded me: Submit only to the greatest of them. said to her: He, too, is the head of a tribe; moreover, he is greater than as he is the second of the womb, and is the third of the womb,
llm_translation: "And Moses said to the judges of Israel, etc." The tribe of Simeon went to Zimri son of Salu, they said to him: 'Are you judging matters of life and death while you sit silent?' What did he do? He stood up and gathered twenty-four thousand from Israel and went to Cozbi. He said to her: 'Inform me.' She said to him: 'I am the daughter of a king, and my father commanded me: Only listen to the greatest among them.' He said to her: 'He is also a prince of a tribe, and not only that, but he is greater than him, for he is second to the belly and he is third to the belly."

hebrew_text: תְּפָשָׂהּ בִּבְלוֹרִיתָהּ וֶהֱבִיאָהּ אֵצֶל מֹשֶׁה. אָמַר לוֹ: בֶּן עַמְרָם, זוֹ אֲסוּרָה אוֹ מוּתֶּרֶת? וְאִם תֹּאמַר אֲסוּרָה, בַּת יִתְרוֹ מִי הִתִּירָה לָךְ? נִתְעַלְּמָה מִמֶּנּוּ הֲלָכָה. גָּעוּ כּוּלָּם בִּבְכִיָּה, וְהַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב: ״וְהֵמָּה בֹכִים פֶּתַח אֹהֶל מוֹעֵד״. וּכְתִיב: ״וַיַּרְא פִּנְחָס בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר״.
human_translation: He seized her by her forelock and brought her before Moses. said to Son of Amram, is this forbidden or permitted? And if you say is forbidden, the daughter of Yitro who permitted her to you? The halakha eluded All bawled in weeping, and that is which is written: “And they are crying at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting” And it is written “And Pinehas, son of Elazar, saw
llm_translation: She caught her in her act of adultery and brought her to Moses. He said to him: "Son of Amram, is this woman forbidden or permitted? And if you say she is forbidden, by whose permission did the daughter of Jethro marry you?" The law was hidden from him. They all burst into tears, as it is written: "And they wept at the entrance of the tent of meeting." And it is written: "And Phinehas the son of Eleazar saw."

hebrew_text: מָה רָאָה? אָמַר רַב: רָאָה מַעֲשֶׂה וְנִזְכַּר הֲלָכָה. אָמַר לוֹ: אֲחִי אֲבִי אַבָּא, לֹא כָּךְ לִימַּדְתַּנִי בְּרִדְתְּךָ מֵהַר סִינַי: הַבּוֹעֵל אֲרָמִית קַנָּאִין פּוֹגְעִין בּוֹ? אָמַר לוֹ: קַרְיָינָא דְּאִיגַּרְתָּא אִיהוּ לֶיהֱוֵי פַּרְוָונְקָא.
human_translation: What did see Rav says: He saw the incident and he remembered the halakha . He said to Brother of the father of my father, did you not teach me this during your descent from Mount Sinai: One who engages in intercourse with a gentile woman, zealots strike him? said to him: Let the one who reads the letter be the agent [ parvanka ]
llm_translation: "What did he see?" Rav said: "He saw an incident and remembered a halakha." He said to him: "My father's brother's father, did you not teach me thus when you descended from Mount Sinai: 'One who cohabits with an Aramean, zealots may attack him'?" He said to him: "The reader of the letter should be a translator."

hebrew_text: וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: רָאָה שֶׁאֵין חׇכְמָה וְאֵין תְּבוּנָה וְאֵין עֵצָה לְנֶגֶד ה׳. כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁיֵּשׁ חִילּוּל הַשֵּׁם, אֵין חוֹלְקִין כָּבוֹד לָרַב. רַבִּי יִצְחָק אָמַר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: רָאָה שֶׁבָּא מַלְאָךְ וְהִשְׁחִית בָּעָם.
human_translation: And Shmuel says: saw “There is neither wisdom nor understanding nor counsel against the Lord” Anywhere that there is desecration of the Lord’s name, one does not show respect to the teacher. Rabbi Yitzḥak Rabbi Eliezer says: He saw that an angel came and destroyed among the people
llm_translation: Samuel said: "He saw that there is no wisdom, understanding, or counsel before the Lord. In any place where there is desecration of the Name, honor is not given to the teacher." Rabbi Yitzchak said in the name of Rabbi Eliezer: "He saw that an angel came and caused destruction among the people."

hebrew_text: ״וַיָּקׇם מִתּוֹךְ הָעֵדָה וַיִּקַּח רֹמַח בְּיָדוֹ״. מִיכָּן, שֶׁאֵין נִכְנָסִין בִּכְלֵי זַיִין לְבֵית הַמִּדְרָשׁ. שָׁלַף שְׁנָנָהּ וְהִנִּיחָהּ בְּאוּנְקָלוֹ, וְהָיָה
human_translation: “He arose from amidst the assembly and he took a spear in his hand” From here, that one does not enter the study hall with a weapon. removed the blade of and placed it in his garment [ be’unkalo ] and he was
llm_translation: "And he arose from within the congregation and took a spear in his hand." From here, we learn that one may not enter with weapons into the study hall. He drew out his shoe and placed it in his sandal, and it was...

hebrew_text: נִשְׁעָן וְהוֹלֵךְ עַל מַקְלוֹ, וְכֵיוָן שֶׁהִגִּיעַ אֵצֶל שִׁבְטוֹ שֶׁל שִׁמְעוֹן אָמַר: הֵיכָן מָצִינוּ שֶׁשִּׁבְטוֹ שֶׁל לֵוִי גָּדוֹל מִשֶּׁל שִׁמְעוֹן? אָמְרוּ: הַנִּיחוּ לוֹ, אַף הוּא לַעֲשׂוֹת צְרָכָיו נִכְנַס. הִתִּירוּ פְּרוּשִׁין אֶת הַדָּבָר.
human_translation: walking, leaning on his stick, And once he reached the tribe of Simeon he said: Where did we find that the tribe of Levi is greater than that of Simeon? said: Allow him he too is entering to attend to his needs the pious have permitted matter,
llm_translation: He leaned and walked on his staff, and once he reached the tribe of Shimon, he said: Where do we find that the tribe of Levi is greater than that of Shimon? They said: Leave him, he too enters to fulfill his needs. The Pharisees permitted the matter.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: שִׁשָּׁה נִסִּים נַעֲשׂוּ לוֹ לְפִנְחָס. אֶחָד, שֶׁהָיָה לוֹ לְזִמְרִי לִפְרוֹשׁ וְלֹא פֵּירַשׁ. וְאֶחָד, שֶׁהָיָה לוֹ לְדַבֵּר וְלֹא דִּבֵּר. וְאֶחָד, שֶׁכִּוֵּון בְּזַכְרוּתוֹ שֶׁל אִישׁ וּבְנַקְבוּתָהּ שֶׁל אִשָּׁה. וְאֶחָד, שֶׁלֹּא נִשְׁמְטוּ מִן הָרוֹמַח. וְאֶחָד, שֶׁבָּא מַלְאָךְ וְהִגְבִּיהַּ אֶת הַמַּשְׁקוֹף. וְאֶחָד, שֶׁבָּא מַלְאָךְ וְהִשְׁחִית בָּעָם.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Six miracles were performed for Pinehas One that Zimri should have separated himself and he did not separate himself. And one that should have spoken and he did not speak. And one that directed to the male genitals of and to the female genitals of And one that did not fall from the spear. And one that an angel came and raised the lintel And one that an angel came and caused destruction among the people,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: Six miracles were performed for Pinchas. One, he had a dagger in his mouth and did not pierce. And one, he had a word in his mouth and did not speak. And one, he intended in his memory of a man and in her femininity of a woman. And one, they did not slip from the spear. And one, an angel came and raised the lintel. And one, an angel came and caused a plague among the people.

hebrew_text: בָּא וַחֲבָטָן לִפְנֵי הַמָּקוֹם, אָמַר לְפָנָיו: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם, עַל אֵלּוּ יִפְּלוּ עֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבָּעָה אֶלֶף מִיִּשְׂרָאֵל? שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״וַיִּהְיוּ הַמֵּתִים בַּמַּגֵּפָה אַרְבָּעָה וְעֶשְׂרִים אָלֶף״. וְהַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיַּעֲמֹד פִּינְחָס וַיְפַלֵּל״.
human_translation: came and slammed them before the Omnipresent said before Him: Master of the Universe, will twenty-four thousand of Israel fall due to these As it is stated: “And those that died in the plague were twenty-four thousand” And that is which is written: “And Pinehas stood and wrought judgment
llm_translation: He came and struck before the Omnipresent, he said before Him: Master of the Universe, for which of these should twenty-four thousand from Israel fall? As it is said, "And the dead in the plague were twenty-four thousand." And this is what is written: "And Pinchas stood up and prayed."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: ״וַיִּתְפַּלֵּל״ לֹא נֶאֱמַר, אֶלָּא ״וַיְפַלֵּל״. מְלַמֵּד כִּבְיָכוֹל, שֶׁעָשָׂה פְּלִילוּת עִם קוֹנוֹ. בִּקְּשׁוּ מַלְאֲכֵי הַשָּׁרֵת לְדׇחֳפוֹ. אָמַר לָהֶן: הַנִּיחוּ לוֹ, קַנַּאי בֶּן קַנַּאי הוּא, מֵשִׁיב חֵימָה בֶּן מֵשִׁיב חֵימָה הוּא.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar says: is not stated And prayed [ vayitpallel ]; rather, vayefalel . teaches that as it were, wrought judgment [ pelilut ] with his Creator. The ministering angels sought to push him said to them: Leave him be; he is a zealot, son of a zealot, he is an alleviator of wrath, son of an alleviator of wrath,
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: "And he prayed" is not stated, rather "and he entreated." This teaches that he engaged in entreaty with his Creator. The ministering angels sought to push him away. He said to them: Leave him alone, for he is a zealous son of a zealous father, he is a passionate son of a passionate father.

hebrew_text: הִתְחִילוּ שְׁבָטִים מְבַזִּין אוֹתוֹ: רְאִיתֶם בֶּן פּוּטִי זֶה, שֶׁפִּיטֵּם אֲבִי אִמּוֹ עֲגָלִים לַעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה, וְהָרַג נְשִׂיא שֵׁבֶט מִיִּשְׂרָאֵל? בָּא הַכָּתוּב וְיִחֲסוֹ: ״פִּנְחָס בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן אַהֲרֹן הַכֹּהֵן״.
human_translation: The tribes began to demean Did you see this son of Puti, As the father of his mother, fattened [ shepittem ] calves for idol worship, and he killed the prince of a tribe of Israel the verse comes and provides his lineage “Pinehas, son of Elazar, son of Aaron the priest”
llm_translation: The tribes began to belittle him: "Have you seen this son of a Putite, whose maternal grandfather fattened calves for idolatry, and he killed a prince of a tribe of Israel? But the Scripture comes and connects him: 'Pinchas son of Eleazar son of Aaron the priest.'"

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לְמֹשֶׁה: הַקְדֵּם לוֹ שָׁלוֹם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לָכֵן אֱמֹר הִנְנִי נוֹתֵן לוֹ אֶת בְּרִיתִי שָׁלוֹם״. וּרְאוּיָה כַּפָּרָה זוֹ שֶׁתְּהֵא מְכַפֶּרֶת וְהוֹלֶכֶת לְעוֹלָם.
human_translation: The Holy One, Blessed be He, said to Moses: Be the first to peace, as it is stated: “Therefore say: I hereby give to him My covenant of peace” and this atonement is worthy of continuing to atone forever.
llm_translation: He said to him the Holy One, blessed be He, to Moses: "Precede him with peace, as it is said: 'Therefore say, behold I give him my covenant of peace.'" And fitting is atonement that it should be atoning and enduring forever.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַב: מַאי דִּכְתִיב ״זַרְזִיר מׇתְנַיִם אוֹ תָיִשׁ וּמֶלֶךְ אַלְקוּם עִמּוֹ״? אַרְבַּע מֵאוֹת וְעֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבַּע בְּעִילוֹת בָּעַל אוֹתוֹ רָשָׁע אוֹתוֹ הַיּוֹם, וְהִמְתִּין לוֹ פִּנְחָס עַד שֶׁתָּשַׁשׁ כֹּחוֹ. וְהוּא אֵינוֹ יוֹדֵעַ שֶׁמֶּלֶךְ אַלְקוּם עִמּוֹ.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman says Rav says: What which is written: “The thigh-belted greyhound [ zarzir ], or the he-goat, and the king against whom none can rise” That wicked engaged in four hundred and twenty-four, acts of intercourse that day. And Pinehas waited until his strength waned And did not know that the king against whom none can rise, with him.
llm_translation: Rav Nahman said in the name of Rav: What is the meaning of the verse, "A sparrow flits not to the ground without your Lord" (1 Samuel 26:20)? Four hundred and twenty-four acts of intercourse did that wicked one perform on that day, and Pinchas waited for him until his strength waned. And he did not know that the King of the Universe was with him.

hebrew_text: בְּמַתְנִיתָא תָּנָא: שִׁשִּׁים, עַד שֶׁנַּעֲשָׂה כְּבֵיצָה הַמּוּזֶרֶת, וְהִיא הָיְתָה כַּעֲרוּגָה מְלֵיאָה מַיִם. אָמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא: וּמוֹשָׁבָהּ בֵּית סְאָה. תָּנֵי רַב יוֹסֵף: קֶבֶר שֶׁלָּהּ אַמָּה.
human_translation: It was taught in a baraita : sixty until became like an addled egg and was like a garden bed full of water. Rav Kahana said And her seat area required for sowing one se’a of seed [ beit se’a ]. Rav Yosef taught: The opening of her womb a cubit.
llm_translation: In the Mishnah it was taught: sixty, until it becomes like a well-sealed egg, and it was full of water. Rav Kahana said: And its sitting area is a Beit Se'ah. Rav Yosef taught: Her grave is a cubit.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: לֹא ״כׇּזְבִּי״ שְׁמָהּ, אֶלָּא ״שְׁוִילְנַאי בַּת צוּר״ שְׁמָהּ. וְלָמָּה נִקְרָא שְׁמָהּ ״כׇּזְבִּי״? שֶׁכִּזְּבָה בְּאָבִיהָ. דָּבָר אַחֵר: ״כׇּזְבִּי״ – שֶׁאָמְרָה לְאָבִיהָ: ״כּוֹס בִּי עַם זֶה״.
human_translation: Rav Sheshet says: Cozbi was not her name; rather, Shevilnai, daughter of Zur, was her name. And why was she called Cozbi? Because she distorted [ shekizzeva ] of her father. Alternatively: Cozbi because she said to her father: Slaughter [ kos ] this people through me [ bi ],
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet said: Her name is not "Kozbi," rather her name is "Shvilnai bat Tzur." And why is she called "Kozbi"? Because she lied to her father. Another explanation: "Kozbi" - because she said to her father, "Cup me with this people."

hebrew_text: וְהַיְינוּ דְּאָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי: ״בֵּין קְנֵי לְאוּרְבָּנֵי, שְׁוִילְנַאי מַאי בָּעֲיָא?״ ״בַּהֲדֵי קְלִפֵּי דִקְנֵי, שְׁוִילְנַאי מַאי בָּעֲיָא?״ גַּפְתָּהּ לְאִמַּהּ.
human_translation: and this is as people say Between reeds and willows, what does Shevilnai seek? Among the peels of the reeds, what does Shevilnai seek? She prostituted her mother.
llm_translation: And this is what people say: "Between the reeds and the willows, what does Shvilnai need?" "In the husks of the reeds, what does Shvilnai need?" He bent it towards its mother.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: חֲמִשָּׁה שֵׁמוֹת יֵשׁ לוֹ: זִמְרִי, וּבֶן סָלוּא, וְשָׁאוּל, וּבֶן הַכְּנַעֲנִית, וּשְׁלוּמִיאֵל בֶּן צוּרִי שַׁדָּי. זִמְרִי – עַל שֶׁנַּעֲשָׂה כְּבֵיצָה הַמּוּזֶרֶת, בֶּן סָלוּא – עַל שֶׁהִסְלִיא עֲוֹנוֹת שֶׁל מִשְׁפַּחְתּוֹ, שָׁאוּל – עַל שֶׁהִשְׁאִיל עַצְמוֹ לִדְבַר עֲבֵירָה, בֶּן הַכְּנַעֲנִית – עַל שֶׁעָשָׂה מַעֲשֵׂה כְנַעַן, וּמָה שְׁמוֹ? שְׁלוּמִיאֵל בֶּן צוּרִי שַׁדָּי שְׁמוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: has five names: Zimri; and son of Salu; and Saul; and son of the Canaanite woman; and Shelumiel, son of Zuri Shaddai. Zimri because of that he became like an addled [ hamuzeret ] egg son of Salu because that he evoked [ shehisli ] the sins of his family. Saul [ Shaul ] because that he lent [ shehishil ] himself to sinful matters. son of the Canaanite woman because that he performed an act of Canaan, And what is his name? Shelumiel, son of Zuri Shaddai, is his name,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: He has five names: Zimri, Ben Salu, Saul, Ben the Canaanite woman, and Shlumiel son of Zurishaddai. Zimri - because he acted like a singing bird, Ben Salu - because he brought shame upon his family, Saul - because he lent himself to sin, Ben the Canaanite woman - because he acted like the Canaanites, and what is his name? Shlumiel son of Zurishaddai is his name.

hebrew_text: כֹּהֵן שֶׁשִּׁימֵּשׁ בְּטוּמְאָה. בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ רַב אַחָא בַּר הוּנָא מֵרַב שֵׁשֶׁת: כֹּהֵן שֶׁשִּׁימֵּשׁ בְּטוּמְאָה, חַיָּיב מִיתָה בִּידֵי שָׁמַיִם אוֹ אֵין חַיָּיב מִיתָה בִּידֵי שָׁמַיִם?
human_translation: a priest who performed service in ritual impurity, Rav Aḥa bar Huna raised a dilemma before Rav Sheshet: a priest who performed service in ritual impurity, liable death at the hand of Heaven or not liable death at the hand of Heaven?
llm_translation: The priest who served in impurity. Rab Ahah bar Huna asked Rav Sheshet: A priest who served in impurity, is he liable to death by the hands of Heaven or is he not liable to death by the hands of Heaven?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: תְּנֵיתוּהָ, כֹּהֵן שֶׁשִּׁימֵּשׁ בְּטוּמְאָה אֵין אֶחָיו הַכֹּהֲנִים מְבִיאִין אוֹתוֹ לְבֵית דִּין, אֶלָּא פִּירְחֵי כְהוּנָּה מוֹצִיאִין אוֹתוֹ חוּץ לָעֲזָרָה וּפוֹצְעִין אֶת מוֹחוֹ בְּגִיזְרִין. וְאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ מְחַיֵּיב בִּידֵי שָׁמַיִם, לִישְׁבְּקֵיהּ דְּלִיקְטוֹל בִּידֵי שָׁמַיִם! אֶלָּא מַאי? אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב.
human_translation: said to him: You learned a priest who performed service in ritual impurity, his priestly brethren do not bring him to court rather, the young of the priesthood remove him from the Temple courtyard and pierce his skull with pieces of wood. And if it enters your mind he is liable at the hand of Heaven, let leave him, so that he will be killed at the hand of Heaven. Rather, what He is not liable
llm_translation: He said to him: "You have taught it: a priest who served in impurity, his priestly brethren do not bring him to the court, rather the young priests take him out to the Azarah and split his brain with axes. And if you think that he is liable to the hands of Heaven, to burn him with the fire of Heaven! Rather, what is it? He is not liable."

hebrew_text: מִי אִיכָּא מִידֵּי דְּרַחֲמָנָא פַּטְרֵיהּ, וַאֲנַן נֵיקוּם וְנִיקְטוֹל לֵיהּ? וְלָא? וְהָתְנַן: מִי שֶׁלָּקָה וְשָׁנָה – בֵּית דִּין מַכְנִיסִין אוֹתוֹ לַכִּיפָּה. רַחֲמָנָא פַּטְרֵיהּ, וַאֲנַן קָטְלִינַן לֵיהּ? הָאָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: בְּמַלְקוֹת שֶׁל כָּרֵיתוֹת עָסְקִינַן, דְּגַבְרָא בַּר קְטָלָא הוּא.
human_translation: Is there any act the Torah absolves him of and we shall arise and execute him? And not But didn’t we learn One who was flogged and repeated court places him into the vaulted chamber? the Merciful One absolves him and we execute him. Doesn’t Rabbi Yirmeya say Reish Lakish says: We are dealing with lashes by karet ? As the man is liable to death
llm_translation: Who is there that the Merciful One has spared from His hand, and we seek vengeance and take him? Is it not so? But didn't we learn: "One who was whipped and changed - the court brings him to the chopping block." The Merciful One spared him, and we seek to kill him? This is as Rabbi Yirmiyah said in the name of Reish Lakish: We are dealing with lashes of rebelliousness, for he is a man of stubbornness.

hebrew_text: וְהָא גּוֹנֵב הַקַּסְוָה? הָאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: בִּכְלִי שָׁרֵת עָסְקִינַן, וּרְמִיזָא: ״לֹא יָבֹאוּ לִרְאוֹת כְּבַלַּע אֶת הַקֹּדֶשׁ וָמֵתוּ״.
human_translation: But isn’t steals a kasva , But doesn’t Rav Yehuda say: We are dealing with a service vessel and is intimated “But they shall not come to see the sacred items as they are being covered, lest they die”
llm_translation: The one who steals the spoon? This is what Rav Yehudah said: We are dealing with a service vessel, and it is hinted: "They shall not come to see the holy things as they are being swallowed, lest they die."

hebrew_text: וְהָא הַמְקַלֵּל אֶת הַקּוֹסֵם? הָא תָּנֵי רַב יוֹסֵף: יַכֶּה קוֹסֵם אֶת קוֹסְמוֹ, דְּמִיחֲזֵי כִּמְבָרֵךְ אֶת הַשֵּׁם.
human_translation: But isn’t one who curses the sorcerer, But didn’t Rav Yosef teach Let the sorcerer strike his sorcerer, which appears like blessing, the name
llm_translation: And this, the one who curses the diviner? This was taught by Rav Yosef: He should strike his diviner, as it appears as if he is blessing the Name.

hebrew_text: וְהָא בּוֹעֵל אֲרָמִית? הָא אַקְרְיוּהּ לְרַב כָּהֲנָא בְּחֶלְמֵיהּ, וְאִדַּכְרֵיהּ רַב לִגְמָרֵיהּ.
human_translation: But isn’t engages in intercourse with an Aramean woman, Didn’t they read to Rav Kahana in his dream and Rav remembered tradition
llm_translation: And this applies to one who cohabits with an Aramaean woman? This issue was brought before Rav Kahana in his dream, and Rav remembered it to complete it.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ: הַיּוֹצֵק, וְהַבּוֹלֵל, וְהַפּוֹתֵת, הַמּוֹלֵחַ, הַמֵּנִיף, הַמַּגִּישׁ, וְהַמְסַדֵּר אֶת הַשּׁוּלְחָן, הַמֵּטִיב אֶת הַנֵּרוֹת, וְהַקּוֹמֵץ, וְהַמְקַבֵּל דָּמִים בַּחוּץ – פָּטוּר.
human_translation: raises an objection to who pours and one who mixes and one who breaks one who salts one who waves one who brings and one who arranges the Table one who removes the ashes the lamps and one who removes the handful and one who collects the blood outside exempt
llm_translation: He raised an objection against him: The founder, the molder, the cutter, the smoother, the waver, the presenter, and the one who arranges the table, the one who makes the lamps good, and the one who gathers, and the one who receives blood outside - is exempt.

hebrew_text: וְאֵין חַיָּיבִין עֲלֵיהֶן
human_translation: And one is not liable for their
llm_translation: And not obligated upon them.

hebrew_text: לֹא מִשּׁוּם זָרוּת, וְלֹא מִשּׁוּם טוּמְאָה, וְלֹא מִשּׁוּם מְחוּסַּר בְּגָדִים, וְלֹא מִשּׁוּם רִחוּץ יָדַיִם וְרַגְלַיִם.
human_translation: neither due to non-priesthood, nor due to ritual impurity; nor due to lacking vestments; nor due to washing of his hands and feet.
llm_translation: Not because of foreignness, and not because of impurity, and not because of lacking garments, and not because of washing hands and feet.

hebrew_text: הָא מְקַטֵּר – חַיָּיב. מַאי לָאו, מִיתָה? לָא, בְּאַזְהָרָה.
human_translation: But burns liable. What, is it not death No, for a prohibition,
llm_translation: The one who burns incense - liable. What, is it not death? No, with a warning.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא זָר נָמֵי לְאַזְהָרָה? וְהָכְתִיב: ״וְהַזָּר הַקָּרֵב יוּמָת״! הָא כִּדְאִיתַאּ וְהָא כִּדְאִיתַאּ.
human_translation: But non-priest liable for a prohibition, But isn’t it written: “And the non-priest who approaches shall be put to death” this as it is, and that as it is;
llm_translation: Rather, is a non-priest fit for warning? But it is written: "And the stranger who comes near shall be put to death"! This one is as that one, and that one is as this one.

hebrew_text: מִכְּלָל דְּיוֹצֵק וּבוֹלֵל לָאו נָמֵי לָא? וְהָתַנְיָא: אַזְהָרָה לְיוֹצֵק וּבוֹלֵל מִנַּיִין? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״קְדֹשִׁים יִהְיוּ וְלֹא יְחַלְּלוּ״. מִדְּרַבָּנַן, וּקְרָא אַסְמַכְתָּא בְּעָלְמָא.
human_translation: by inference, who pours and one who mixes does not even a prohibition? But isn’t it taught From where a prohibition against pouring and mixing the verse states: “They shall be sacred to their God and they shall not profane by rabbinic law, and the verse is a mere support,
llm_translation: From the principle that a smelter and a molder are not the same? And it was taught: A warning to a smelter and a molder, from where? The Talmud teaches: "They shall be holy, and they shall not profane." From the Rabbis, and the verse is a mere support.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: וְאֵלּוּ הֵן שֶׁבְּמִיתָה – טָמֵא שֶׁשִּׁימֵּשׁ. תְּיוּבְתָּא!
human_translation: raises an objection And these are they who to death an impure who performed service. a conclusive refutation
llm_translation: Challenger: And these are the ones who are considered impure through contact with a dead body - one who touched. A refutation!

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא: וְאֵלּוּ שֶׁבְּמִיתָה – הָאוֹכֵל אֶת הַטֶּבֶל, וְכֹהֵן טָמֵא שֶׁאָכַל תְּרוּמָה טְהוֹרָה, וְזָר שֶׁאָכַל אֶת הַתְּרוּמָה, וְזָר שֶׁשִּׁימֵּשׁ, וְטָמֵא שֶׁשִּׁימֵּשׁ, וּטְבוּל יוֹם שֶׁשִּׁימֵּשׁ, וּמְחוּסַּר בְּגָדִים, וּמְחוּסַּר כַּפָּרָה, וְשֶׁלֹּא רָחַץ יָדַיִם וְרַגְלַיִם, וּשְׁתוּיֵי יַיִן, וּפְרוּעֵי רֹאשׁ.
human_translation: the itself, And these who to death One who partakes of untithed produce, and a ritually impure priest who partook of ritually pure teruma , and a non-priest who partook of teruma , and a non-priest who performed service, and a ritually impure who performed service, and who immersed that day who performed service, and lacking vestments, and who has not yet an atonement and who did not wash his hands and feet and intoxicated with wine, and overgrown heads.
llm_translation: Body: And these are cases of death - one who eats tevel, and a tamei kohen who ate pure terumah, and a zar who ate the terumah, and a zar who served, and a tamei who served, and one who immersed on the day he served, and one lacking garments, and one lacking atonement, and one who did not wash his hands and feet, and those who drank wine, and those with disheveled hair.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל עָרֵל, וְאוֹנֵן, וְיוֹשֵׁב – אֵינָן בְּמִיתָה אֶלָּא בְּאַזְהָרָה. בַּעַל מוּם – רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: בְּמִיתָה, וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: בָּאַזְהָרָה.
human_translation: But uncircumcised or an acute mourner or seated, are not with death rather, for a prohibition. a blemished Rabbi says: with death and the Rabbis say: for a prohibition.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: But uncircumcised, and a mourner, and one who is sitting - they are not liable to death, only to warning. A blemished animal - Rabbi says: to death, and the Sages say: to warning.

hebrew_text: הֵזִיד בִּמְעִילָה, רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: בְּמִיתָה, וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: בָּאַזְהָרָה.
human_translation: intentionally performed misuse Rabbi says: with death and the Rabbis say: for a prohibition.
llm_translation: He acted intentionally with a cloak, Rabbi says: with intent to kill, and the Sages say: with warning.

hebrew_text: הָאוֹכֵל אֶת הַטֶּבֶל, מְנָלַן? דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: מִנַּיִין לְאוֹכֵל אֶת הַטֶּבֶל שֶׁהוּא בְּמִיתָה? דִּכְתִיב: ״וְלֹא יְחַלְּלוּ אֶת קׇדְשֵׁי בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל [אֵת] אֲשֶׁר יָרִימוּ לַה׳״. בַּעֲתִידִים לִתְרוֹם הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר.
human_translation: one who partakes of untithed produce From where do we As Shmuel says in the name of Rabbi Eliezer: From where that one who partakes of untithed produce with death as it is written: “They shall not desecrate the sacred items of the children of Israel, which they will set apart unto the Lord” the verse is speaking that are destined to be separated
llm_translation: The one who eats tevel, from where? As Shmuel said in the name of Rabbi Eliezer: From where do we derive that one who eats tevel is liable to receive the death penalty? As it is written: "And they shall not profane the holy things of the children of Israel, which they offer unto the Lord." In the future, the Scripture speaks of those who will contribute.

hebrew_text: וְיָלֵיף ״חִילּוּל״ ״חִילּוּל״ מִתְּרוּמָה, מָה לְהַלָּן בְּמִיתָה – אַף כָּאן בְּמִיתָה.
human_translation: And derives desecration from desecration teruma Just as there, with death so too here, with death
llm_translation: And he deduced "chilul" "chilul" from terumah, just as there it is punishable by death - so too here it is punishable by death.

hebrew_text: וְנֵילַף ״חִילּוּל״ ״חִילּוּל״ מִנּוֹתָר: מָה לְהַלָּן בְּכָרֵת, אַף כָּאן בְּכָרֵת.
human_translation: And let us derive desecration desecration leftover from an offering after the time allotted for its consumption [ notar ] Just as there, with karet , so too here, with karet .
llm_translation: And it was taught: "Chilul" "Chilul" from "notar": Just as there it is punishable by karet, so too here it is punishable by karet.

hebrew_text: מִסְתַּבְּרָא מִתְּרוּמָה הֲוָה לֵיהּ לְמֵילַף, שֶׁכֵּן תְּרוּמָה: חוּצָה לָאָרֶץ, הוּתְּרָה, בְּרַבִּים, פֵּירוֹת, פִּיגּוּל וְנוֹתָר.
human_translation: It is reasonable he should have derived from teruma , as teruma ; outside of Eretz permitted, in the plural, produce; an offering that was sacrificed with the intent to consume it after its designated time [ piggul ], nor notar ,
llm_translation: He was considered as if he had separated terumah, for such is terumah: outside the land, it is permitted, in public, fruits, a blemished animal, and a leftover.

hebrew_text: אַדְּרַבָּה, מִנּוֹתָר הֲוָה לֵיהּ לְמֵילַף, שֶׁכֵּן פְּסוּל אוֹכֶל, אֵין לוֹ הֶיתֵּר בְּמִקְוֶה. הָנָךְ נְפִישָׁן. רָבִינָא אָמַר: חִילּוּל דְּרַבִּים מֵחִילּוּל דְּרַבִּים עָדִיף.
human_translation: On the contrary, he should have derived from notar , as unfitness of the food, there is no permission in the ritual bath, Those are more numerous, Ravina says: desecration in the plural from desecration in the plural is preferable.
llm_translation: AdRabba, minotar hava lei l'meilaf, sheken pesul okhel, ein lo heter b'mikveh. Hanach nafishan. Ravina amar: chilul d'rabim me'chilul d'rabim adif.

hebrew_text: וְכֹהֵן טָמֵא שֶׁאָכַל תְּרוּמָה טְהוֹרָה מְנָלַן? דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: מִנַּיִין לְכֹהֵן טָמֵא שֶׁאָכַל תְּרוּמָה טְהוֹרָה שֶׁהוּא בְּמִיתָה בִּידֵי שָׁמַיִם? דִּכְתִיב: ״וְשָׁמְרוּ אֶת מִשְׁמַרְתִּי וְלֹא יִשְׂאוּ עָלָיו חֵטְא וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: From where do we that an impure priest who partook of pure teruma as Shmuel says: From where to an impure priest who partakes of pure teruma that with death at the hand of Heaven? as it is written “And they shall keep my charge lest they bear a sin for it
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And a impure priest who ate pure terumah, from where? For Samuel said: From where does an impure priest who ate pure terumah derive that he is liable to death by the hands of Heaven? As it is written: "And they shall keep My charge, and not bear sin because of it, etc."

hebrew_text: טְהוֹרָה – אִין, טְמֵאָה – לָא. דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: מִנַּיִין לְכֹהֵן טָמֵא שֶׁאָכַל תְּרוּמָה טְמֵאָה שֶׁאֵינוֹ בְּמִיתָה? שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּמֵתוּ בוֹ כִּי יְחַלְּלֻהוּ״,
human_translation: ritually pure yes, impure no, as Shmuel says Rabbi Eliezer says: From where that an impure priest who partakes of impure teruma is not with death as it is stated “And die therein if they desecrate it,”
llm_translation: Purity - no, impurity - yes. For Shmuel said in the name of Rabbi Eliezer: From where do we derive that a ritually impure priest who ate impure terumah is not liable to death? As it is stated: "And they shall die in it if they profane it."

hebrew_text: פְּרָט לָזוֹ שֶׁמְּחוּלֶּלֶת וְעוֹמֶדֶת.
human_translation: to the exclusion of that is already desecrated.
llm_translation: Detail to this that is desecrated and standing.

hebrew_text: וְזָר שֶׁאָכַל אֶת הַתְּרוּמָה, אָמַר רַב: זָר שֶׁאָכַל אֶת הַתְּרוּמָה לוֹקֶה. אָמְרִי לֵיהּ רַב כָּהֲנָא וְרַב אַסִּי לְרַב: לֵימָא מָר בְּמִיתָה, דִּכְתִיב ״וְכׇל זָר לֹא יֹאכַל קֹדֶשׁ״?
human_translation: A non-priest who partook of teruma to death Rav says: A non-priest who partook of teruma is flogged. Rav Kahana and Rav Asi said to Rav: Let the Master say with death as it is written: No non-priest shall eat of the sacred,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And a non-priest who ate terumah, Rav said: A non-priest who ate terumah is liable. Rav Kahana and Rav Asi said to Rav: Let the Master say it is punishable by death, as it is written, "But no outsider shall eat holy things."

hebrew_text: ״אֲנִי ה׳ מְקַדְּשָׁם״ – הִפְסִיק הָעִנְיָן. מֵיתִיבִי: וְאֵלּוּ הֵן שֶׁבְּמִיתָה – זָר הָאוֹכֵל אֶת הַתְּרוּמָה. מַתְנִיתָא אַדְּרַב קָא רָמֵית? רַב תַּנָּא הוּא וּפָלֵיג!
human_translation: “I am the Lord Who sanctifies them” ends the matter raises an objection And these are they who to death A non-priest who partakes of teruma . Are you raising a contradiction a baraita to of Rav? Rav is a tanna , and dispute
llm_translation: "I am the Lord who sanctifies them" - the matter was interrupted. It was asked: And what are the cases of death? - A non-priest who eats the terumah. The Mishnah - did you really raise an objection? It is a dispute of a Tanna and a Tanna!

hebrew_text: וְזָר שֶׁשִּׁימֵּשׁ, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְהַזָּר הַקָּרֵב יוּמָת״.
human_translation: a non-priest who performed service as it is written: and any non-priest who approaches shall die”
llm_translation: And a non-priest who serves, as it is written: "But the outsider who comes near shall be put to death."

hebrew_text: וְטָמֵא שֶׁשִּׁימֵּשׁ, כְּדִבְעָא מִינֵּיהּ רַב חִיָּיא בַּר אָבִין מֵרַב יוֹסֵף: מִנַּיִין לְטָמֵא שֶׁשִּׁימֵּשׁ שֶׁהוּא בְּמִיתָה? דִּכְתִיב: ״דַּבֵּר אֶל אַהֲרֹן וְאֶל בָּנָיו וְיִנָּזְרוּ מִקׇּדְשֵׁי בְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל וְלֹא יְחַלְּלוּ אֶת שֵׁם קׇדְשִׁי״.
human_translation: an impure who performed service As Rav Ḥiyya bar Avin asked of Rav Yosef: From where that an impure who performed service is with death as it is written “Speak to Aaron and his sons that they shall separate themselves from the sacred items of the children of Israel and they shall not desecrate My sacred name:
llm_translation: And one who became impure through contact, as Rab Chiya bar Avin said in the name of Rav Yosef: From where do we derive that one who became impure through contact is liable to receive the death penalty? For it is written: "Speak to Aaron and to his sons, that they separate themselves from the holy things of the children of Israel, and that they do not profane My holy name."

hebrew_text: וְיָלֵיף ״חִילּוּל״ ״חִילּוּל״ מִתְּרוּמָה, מָה לְהַלָּן בְּמִיתָה – אַף כָּאן בְּמִיתָה.
human_translation: And derives desecration from desecration teruma Just as there, with death so too here, with death
llm_translation: And he juxtaposes "chilul" "chilul" from terumah, what there in death - also here in death.

hebrew_text: וְנֵילַף ״חִילּוּל״ ״חִילּוּל״ מִנּוֹתָר: מָה לְהַלָּן כָּרֵת, אַף כָּאן כָּרֵת?
human_translation: And let us derive desecration from desecration notar . just as there, karet , so too here, karet .
llm_translation: And we switch "chilul" "chilul" from remaining: Just as there, karet, so too here, karet.

hebrew_text: מִסְתַּבְּרָא מִתְּרוּמָה הֲוָה לֵיהּ לְמֵילַף, שֶׁכֵּן: גּוּף, טָמֵא, מִקְוֶה, בְּרַבִּים.
human_translation: It is reasonable from teruma he should have derived as body impurity; a ritual bath; in the plural,
llm_translation: The text reads: "When a terumah is mixed in, it is considered as the majority, as it is written: 'A body, impure, a mikveh, in a multitude.'"

hebrew_text: אַדְּרַבָּה, מִנּוֹתָר הֲוָה לֵיהּ לְמֵילַף, שֶׁכֵּן קֹדֶשׁ, פְּנִים, פִּיגּוּל וְנוֹתָר! חִילּוּל דְּרַבִּים מֵחִילּוּל דְּרַבִּים עֲדִיף.
human_translation: On the contrary, from notar he should have derived as sacrificial inside piggul and notar desecration in the plural from desecration in the plural is preferable.
llm_translation: אַדְּרַבָּה, מִנּוֹתָר הֲוָה לֵיהּ לְמֵילַף, שֶׁכֵּן קֹדֶשׁ, פְּנִים, פִּיגּוּל וְנוֹתָר! חִילּוּל דְּרַבִּים מֵחִילּוּל דְּרַבִּים עֲדִיף. Adrabah, minotar hava leih lemilaf, sheken kodesh, penim, pigul venotar! Chilul derabim mechilul derabim adif.

hebrew_text: טְבוּל יוֹם שֶׁשִּׁימֵּשׁ, מְנָלַן? דְּתַנְיָא: רַבִּי סִימַאי אוֹמֵר, רֶמֶז לִטְבוּל יוֹם שֶׁאִם עָבַד חִילֵּל מִנַּיִין? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״קְדֹשִׁים יִהְיוּ לֵאלֹהֵיהֶם וְלֹא יְחַלְּלוּ״.
human_translation: who immersed that day who performed service, From where do we as it is taught Rabbi Simai says: From where allusion with regard to who immersed that day, that if he performed service he desecrated the verse states: “They shall be sacred to their God and they shall not desecrate
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Tevul Yom she'shimmesh, menalan? D'tanya: Rabbi Simai omer, remez l'Tevul Yom she'im avad chilel minayin? Talmud lomar: 'Kedoshim yihyu leEloheihem v'lo yechalelu'." English translation: "A Tevul Yom who immersed, from where? As it was taught: Rabbi Simai says, a hint for a Tevul Yom, if he acted to desecrate, from where? The Talmud says: 'They shall be holy to their God and not profane.'"

hebrew_text: אִם אֵינוֹ עִנְיָן לְטָמֵא שֶׁשִּׁימֵּשׁ, דְּנָפְקָא לַן מִ״וְיִנָּזְרוּ״, תְּנֵיהוּ עִנְיָן לִטְבוּל יוֹם שֶׁשִּׁימֵּשׁ.
human_translation: If is not matter of an impure who performed service, as derived for us from “That they shall separate themselves apply it matter of who immersed that day who performed service.
llm_translation: If it is not a matter to become impure that he touched, for we derive from "and they shall separate themselves," both of them are a matter to immerse the day that he touched.

hebrew_text: וְיָלֵיף חִילּוּל חִילּוּל מִתְּרוּמָה, מָה לְהַלָּן בְּמִיתָה – אַף כָּאן בְּמִיתָה.
human_translation: And derives desecration from desecration teruma Just as there, with death so too here, with death
llm_translation: And he shall compare desecration of desecration to terumah, just as there regarding death - so too here regarding death.

hebrew_text: וּמְחוּסַּר בְּגָדִים מְנָלַן? אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, וּמָטוּ בָּהּ מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: ״וְחָגַרְתָּ אֹתָם אַבְנֵט״.
human_translation: And who is lacking vestments From where do we Rabbi Abbahu says Rabbi Yoḥanan says, and determined in the name of Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon: “You shall gird them with a belt,
llm_translation: "And lacking garments, from where? Rabbi Avahu said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan, and they found in it from the name of Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Shimon: 'And you shall gird them with a sash.'"

hebrew_text: בִּזְמַן שֶׁבִּגְדֵיהֶם עֲלֵיהֶם – כְּהוּנָּתָם עֲלֵיהֶם; אֵין בִּגְדֵיהֶם עֲלֵיהֶם – אֵין כְּהוּנָּתָם עֲלֵיהֶם. וְהָווּ לְהוּ זָרִים, וְאָמַר מָר: זָר שֶׁשִּׁימֵּשׁ – בְּמִיתָה.
human_translation: At a time when their vestments are upon them, their priesthood is upon them; their vestments are not upon them, their priesthood is not upon them. assume non-priests and the Master says A non-priest who per-forms service with death
llm_translation: In a time when their garments are upon them - their priesthood is upon them; if their garments are not upon them - their priesthood is not upon them. And if strangers served, and the Master said: A stranger who served - with death.

hebrew_text: וּמְחוּסַּר כַּפָּרָה מְנָלַן? אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: דְּאָמַר קְרָא ״וְכִפֶּר עָלֶיהָ הַכֹּהֵן וְטָהֵרָה״. טָהֵרָה, מִכְּלָל שֶׁהִיא טְמֵאָה. וְאָמַר מָר: טָמֵא שֶׁשִּׁימֵּשׁ – בְּמִיתָה.
human_translation: And who has not yet an atonement From where do we Rav Huna says: as the verse states “And the priest shall atone for her and she shall become purified” “shall become purified,” by inference, that she is impure And the Master says An impure who performs service with death
llm_translation: And lacking atonement from where? Rav Huna said: As the verse says, "and the priest shall make atonement for her, and she shall be clean." She shall be clean, implying that she was impure. And Mar said: One who engaged in relations - through her death.

hebrew_text: וְשֶׁלֹּא רְחוּץ יָדַיִם וְרַגְלַיִם, מְנָלַן? דִּכְתִיב: ״בְּבֹאָם אֶל אֹהֶל מוֹעֵד יִרְחֲצוּ מַיִם וְלֹא יָמוּתוּ״.
human_translation: And whose hands and feet are not washed From where do we as it is written: “Whenever they come to the Tent of Meeting, they shall wash with water that they shall not die”
llm_translation: "And if one did not wash hands and feet, from where do we know this? As it is written: 'When they go into the tent of meeting, they shall wash with water, so that they will not die.'"

hebrew_text: וּשְׁתוּיֵי יַיִן, דִּכְתִיב: ״יַיִן וְשֵׁכָר אַל תֵּשְׁתְּ וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: And intoxicated with wine as it is written: “Drink no wine nor strong drink,
llm_translation: And drinkers of wine, as it is written: "Wine and strong drink you shall not drink, etc."

hebrew_text: וּפְרוּעֵי רֹאשׁ, דִּכְתִיב: ״רֹאשָׁם לֹא יְגַלֵּחוּ וּפֶרַע לֹא יְשַׁלֵּחוּ״, וּכְתִיב בָּתְרֵיהּ: ״וְיַיִן לֹא יִשְׁתּוּ״. אִיתַּקַּשׁ פְּרוּעֵי רֹאשׁ לִשְׁתוּיֵי יַיִן: מָה שְׁתוּיֵי יַיִן בְּמִיתָה, אַף פְּרוּעֵי רֹאשׁ בְּמִיתָה.
human_translation: And overgrown heads as it is written: “Neither shall they shave their heads nor allow their hair to grow long” and it is written thereafter: “Neither shall any priest drink wine One with overgrown head is juxtaposed to who are intoxicated with wine. Just as intoxicated with wine with death so too overgrown heads with death
llm_translation: The loose-haired ones of the head, as it is written: "They shall not shave their heads bald, and the corner of their beard they shall not cut." And it is written afterwards: "And they shall not drink wine." The loosening of the hair of the head is compared to the drinking of wine: just as the drinking of wine leads to death, so too the loosening of the hair of the head leads to death.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל עָרֵל, אוֹנֵן, יוֹשֵׁב – בְּאַזְהָרָה. עָרֵל מְנָלַן? אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: דָּבָר זֶה מִתּוֹרַת מֹשֶׁה רַבֵּינוּ לֹא לָמַדְנוּ, עַד שֶׁבָּא יְחֶזְקֵאל בֶּן בּוּזִי וְלִמְּדָנוּ: ״כׇּל בֶּן נֵכָר עֶרֶל לֵב
human_translation: But uncircumcised, or an acute mourner or seated, for a prohibition From where do we an uncircumcised Rav Ḥisda says: This matter we did not learn from the Torah of Moses our teacher. until Ezekiel, son of Buzi, came and taught us, “No foreigner uncircumcised in heart
llm_translation: But uncircumcised, mourner, resident - with warning. Uncircumcised from where? Rav Ḥisdah said: This matter we did not learn from the Torah of Moses our teacher until Ezekiel son of Buzi came and taught us: "Every foreigner's heart is uncircumcised."

hebrew_text: וְעֶרֶל בָּשָׂר לֹא יָבוֹא אֶל מִקְדָּשִׁי (לְשָׁרְתֵנִי)״.
human_translation: or uncircumcised in flesh may enter My Temple”
llm_translation: And uncircumcised flesh shall not come into My sanctuary (to serve Me).

hebrew_text: אוֹנֵן מְנָלַן? דִּכְתִיב: ״וּמִן הַמִּקְדָּשׁ לֹא יֵצֵא וְלֹא יְחַלֵּל אֵת מִקְדַּשׁ אֱלֹהָיו״. הָא אַחֵר שֶׁלֹּא יָצָא, חִילֵּל.
human_translation: From where do we an acute mourner as it is written “And from the Temple he shall not emerge and he shall not desecrate the Temple of his God” that another, who did not emerge has desecrated
llm_translation: Mourner from where? As it is written: "And he shall not go out of the sanctuary, nor profane the sanctuary of his God." If another one went out, he profaned.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַדָּא לְרָבָא: וְנֵילַף ״חִילּוּל״ ״חִילּוּל״ מִתְּרוּמָה, מָה לְהַלָּן בְּמִיתָה – אַף כָּאן בְּמִיתָה.
human_translation: Rav Adda said to Rava: And let us derive desecration from desecration teruma . Just as there, with death so too here, with death
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Adda to Rava: And we learn "chilul" "chilul" from terumah, just as there regarding death - so too here regarding death.

hebrew_text: מִי כְּתִיב בֵּיהּ בְּגוּפֵיהּ? מִכְּלָלָא קָאָתֵי. הָוֵי דָּבָר הַבָּא מִן הַכְּלָל, וְכׇל דָּבָר הַבָּא מִן הַכְּלָל אֵין דָּנִין אוֹתוֹ בִּגְזֵרָה שָׁוָה.
human_translation: Is written with regard to itself? It is derived from by inference. it is a matter that emerges from an inference, Any matter that emerges from an inference cannot be derived by means of a verbal analogy.
llm_translation: Who is written in it in his body? It stands in general. Be a matter that comes from the general, and any matter that comes from the general is not judged in a similar decree.

hebrew_text: יוֹשֵׁב מְנָלַן? אָמַר רָבָא אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: אָמַר קְרָא ״כִּי בוֹ בָּחַר ה׳ אֱלֹהֶיךָ מִכׇּל שְׁבָטֶיךָ לַעֲמֹד לְשָׁרֵת״. לַעֲמִידָה בְּחַרְתִּיו, וְלֹא לִישִׁיבָה.
human_translation: From where do we that seated Rava says Rav Naḥman says: The verse states: “For him has the Lord chosen from among all your tribes, to stand and minister I chose him for standing, but not for seated.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates as follows: "Yoshev Menalan? Rava said, Rav Nachman said: The verse says, 'For the Lord your God has chosen him out of all your tribes to stand to serve.' I have chosen him for standing, and not for sitting."

hebrew_text: בַּעַל מוּם: רַבִּי אוֹמֵר בְּמִיתָה, וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים בָּאַזְהָרָה. מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי? דִּכְתִיב: ״אַךְ אֶל הַפָּרֹכֶת לֹא יָבֹא וְגוֹ׳״, וְיָלֵיף חִילּוּל חִילּוּל מִתְּרוּמָה. מָה לְהַלָּן בְּמִיתָה, אַף כָּאן בְּמִיתָה.
human_translation: a blemished Rabbi says: with death and the Rabbis say: for a prohibition. What is the reason of Rabbi as it is written: “But he shall not come into the curtain And derives desecration from desecration teruma . Just as there, with death so too here, with death
llm_translation: Baal Mum: Rabbi says in death, and the sages say in warning. What is the reason of Rabbi? As it is written: "But into the veil, he shall not come," and he deduces desecration of desecration from terumah. Just as there it is punishable by death, so too here it is punishable by death.

hebrew_text: וְנֵילַף ״חִילּוּל״ ״חִילּוּל״ מִנּוֹתָר: מָה לְהַלָּן בְּכָרֵת, אַף כָּאן בְּכָרֵת?
human_translation: And let us derive desecration from desecration notar . Just as there, with karet , so too here, with karet .
llm_translation: And it was taught: "Chilul" "Chilul" from "minotar": Just as there in the case of karet, so too here it is punishable with karet.

hebrew_text: מִסְתַּבְּרָא מִתְּרוּמָה הֲוָה לֵיהּ לְמֵילַף, שֶׁכֵּן פְּסוּל הַגּוּף מִפְּסוּל הַגּוּף. אַדְּרַבָּה, מִנּוֹתָר הֲוָה לֵיהּ לְמֵילַף, שֶׁכֵּן קוֹדֶשׁ, פְּנִים, פִּיגּוּל וְנוֹתָר.
human_translation: It is reasonable he should have derived from teruma , as the bodily disqualification from the bodily disqualification On the contrary, he should have derived from notar , sacrificial inside piggul and notar
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "If he had a defect in the offering, he was fit for redemption, for the disqualification of the body is like the disqualification of the body. On the contrary, if he had a defect in the offering, he was fit for redemption, for such is the holiness, the inside, the pigul, and the remainder."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, מִטָּמֵא שֶׁשִּׁימֵּשׁ גָּמַר. פְּסוּל הַגּוּף מִפְּסוּל הַגּוּף, קוֹדֶשׁ פְּנִים פִּיגּוּל וְנוֹתָר מִקּוֹדֶשׁ פְּנִים פִּיגּוּל וְנוֹתָר.
human_translation: Rather, derives from an impure who performed service, the bodily disqualification from the bodily disqualification sacrificial inside piggul and notar , from sacrificial inside piggul and notar .
llm_translation: Rather, from impurity that has been touched is complete. Disqualification of the body from disqualification of the body, holy inside is like profane and leftover from holy inside is like profane and leftover.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן, אָמַר קְרָא: ״בּוֹ״, וְלֹא בְּבַעַל מוּם.
human_translation: And the Rabbis, the verse states: because of it “Because of it” but not a blemished
llm_translation: The sages said: The verse states "bo" (in him), and not "beba'al mum" (in a blemished one).

hebrew_text: הֵזִיד בִּמְעִילָה: רַבִּי אוֹמֵר בְּמִיתָה, וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים בָּאַזְהָרָה. מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי? אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: גָּמַר חֵטְא חֵטְא מִתְּרוּמָה. מָה לְהַלָּן בְּמִיתָה – אַף כָּאן בְּמִיתָה.
human_translation: intentionally performed misuse Rabbi says: with death and the Rabbis say: for a prohibition. What is the reason of Rabbi Rabbi Abbahu says: He derives sin from sin teruma Just as there, with death so too here, with death
llm_translation: Intentional sin with a garment: Rabbi says punishable by death, and the Sages say punishable by warning. What is the reason for Rabbi's opinion? Rabbi Avahu said: He has completed committing a sin punishable by terumah. Just as there it is punishable by death - so too here it is punishable by death.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן אָמְרִי: אָמַר קְרָא ״בּוֹ״, ״בּוֹ״ וְלֹא בִּמְעִילָה.
human_translation: And the Rabbis say the verse states “Because of it” but not in misuse
llm_translation: The Sages said: The verse says "bo," "bo" and not in a cloak.

hebrew_text: זָר שֶׁשִּׁימֵּשׁ בְּמִקְדָּשׁ: תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל אוֹמֵר: נֶאֱמַר כָּאן ״וְהַזָּר הַקָּרֵב יוּמָת״, וְנֶאֱמַר לְהַלָּן ״כֹּל הַקָּרֵב הַקָּרֵב אֶל מִשְׁכָּן ה׳ יָמוּת״. מָה לְהַלָּן בִּידֵי שָׁמַיִם, אַף כָּאן בִּידֵי שָׁמַיִם.
human_translation: a non-priest who performed service. It is taught Rabbi Yishmael says: It is stated here: …and any non-priest who approaches shall be put to death [ yumat ]” and it is stated there: “Anyone who approaches the Tabernacle of the Lord shall die [ yamut ]” Just as there, at the hand of Heaven; so too here, at the hand of Heaven.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: A non-priest who served in the Temple: It was taught, Rabbi Yishmael says: It is stated here "and the outsider who approaches shall be put to death," and it is stated there "any outsider who approaches the Tabernacle of the Lord shall be put to death." Just as there, it is in the hands of Heaven, so too here, it is in the hands of Heaven.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: נֶאֱמַר כָּאן ״וְהַזָּר הַקָּרֵב יוּמָת״, וְנֶאֱמַר לְהַלָּן ״וְהַנָּבִיא הַהוּא אוֹ חֹלֵם הַחֲלוֹם הַהוּא יוּמָת״. מָה לְהַלָּן בִּסְקִילָה, אַף כָּאן בִּסְקִילָה. רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן נוּרִי אוֹמֵר: מָה לְהַלָּן בְּחֶנֶק, אַף כָּאן בְּחֶנֶק.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva says it is stated here: “And any non-priest who approaches shall be put to death [ yumat ]” and it is stated there: “And that prophet or that dreamer of a dream shall be put to death [ yumat ]” Just as there, by stoning, so too here, by stoning. Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Nuri says: Just as there, by strangulation, so too here, by strangulation.
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: It is stated here "and the stranger who comes near shall be put to death," and it is stated there "and that prophet or dreamer of dreams shall be put to death." Just as there it is by stoning, so too here it is by stoning. Rabbi Yochanan ben Nuri says: Just as there it is by strangulation, so too here it is by strangulation.

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי קָמִיפַּלְגִי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא? רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא סָבַר: דָּנִין ״יוּמָת״ מִ״יּוּמָת״, וְאֵין דָּנִין ״יוּמָת״ מִ״יָּמוּת״. וְרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל סָבַר: דָּנִין הֶדְיוֹט מֵהֶדְיוֹט, וְאֵין דָּנִין הֶדְיוֹט מִנָּבִיא. וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: כֵּיוָן שֶׁהִדִּיחַ – אֵין לְךָ הֶדְיוֹט גָּדוֹל מִזֶּה.
human_translation: With regard to what do Rabbi Yishmael and Rabbi Akiva disagree? Rabbi Akiva holds: one derives yumat from yumat and one does not derive yumat from yamut . And Rabbi Yishmael holds: one derives an ordinary from an ordinary and one does not derive an ordinary from a prophet. And Rabbi Akiva Once incited you have no greater an ordinary than that,
llm_translation: With what do Rabbi Yishmael and Rabbi Akiva disagree? Rabbi Akiva holds: we interpret "yumat" from "yumat," and we do not interpret "yumat" from "yamut." And Rabbi Yishmael holds: we interpret the ordinary person from the ordinary person, and we do not interpret the ordinary person from the prophet. And Rabbi Akiva says: once he has pushed aside - you have no ordinary person greater than this.

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי קָמִיפַּלְגִי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן נוּרִי? בִּפְלוּגְתָּא דְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן וְרַבָּנַן, דְּתַנְיָא: נָבִיא שֶׁהִדִּיחַ – בִּסְקִילָה. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: בְּחֶנֶק. הָא אֲנַן תְּנַן: רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: בְּחֶנֶק.
human_translation: With regard to what do Rabbi Akiva and Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Nuri disagree? with regard to the dispute of Rabbi Shimon and the Rabbis, as it is taught A prophet who incited by stoning. Rabbi Shimon says: by strangulation. Didn’t we learn Rabbi Akiva says: by strangulation,
llm_translation: In what do Rabbi Akiva and Rabbi Yochanan ben Nuri disagree? In the dispute of Rabbi Shimon and the Rabbis, as it was taught: A false prophet - by stoning. Rabbi Shimon says: By strangulation. But we learned: Rabbi Akiva says: By strangulation.

hebrew_text: תְּרֵי תַּנָּאֵי וְאַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא. מַתְנִיתִין – רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן וְאַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא. בָּרַיְיתָא – רַבָּנַן וְאַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא.
human_translation: two tanna’im and with regard to of Rabbi Akiva. The mishna, Rabbi Shimon in accordance with of Rabbi Akiva. The baraita , the Rabbis, and in accordance with of Rabbi Akiva.
llm_translation: Two Tannaim and the student of Rabbi Akiva. Mishnah - Rabbi Shimon and the student of Rabbi Akiva. Baraita - The Rabbis and the student of Rabbi Akiva.
