hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ אֵלּוּ הֵן הַנִּשְׂרָפִין.
llm_translation: We will return to you: These are the ones who are burned.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי' אֵלּוּ הֵן הַנֶּחְנָקִין הַמַּכֶּה אָבִיו וְאִמּוֹ וְגוֹנֵב נֶפֶשׁ מִיִּשְׂרָאֵל וְזָקֵן מַמְרֵא עַל פִּי בֵּית דִּין וּנְבִיא הַשֶּׁקֶר וְהַמִּתְנַבֵּא בְּשֵׁם עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה וְהַבָּא עַל אֵשֶׁת אִישׁ וְזוֹמְמֵי בַּת כֹּהֵן וּבוֹעֲלָהּ
human_translation: These are who are strangled One who strikes his father or his mother, and one who abducts a Jewish person, and a rebellious elder according to court, and a false prophet, and one who prophesies in the name of idol worship, and one who engages in intercourse with a married woman, and conspiring the daughter of a priest And her paramour
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: These are the ones who are liable to strangulation: one who strikes his father or mother, one who kidnaps a soul from among the children of Israel, a rebellious elder who defies the court, a false prophet, one who prophesies in the name of idolatry, one who engages in relations with another man's wife, those who falsely accuse a kohen's daughter of adultery, and one who marries her.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ' מַכֵּה אָבִיו וְאִמּוֹ מְנָלַן דִּכְתִיב וּמַכֵּה אָבִיו וְאִמּוֹ מוֹת יוּמָת וְכׇל מִיתָה הָאֲמוּרָה בַּתּוֹרָה סְתָם אֵינָהּ אֶלָּא חֶנֶק
human_translation: One who strikes his father or his mother From where do we as it is written: “One who strikes his father or his mother shall be put to death” and every death stated in the Torah without specification nothing other than strangulation.
llm_translation: Gemara: If one strikes his father and mother, from where do we derive that it is written, "And one who strikes his father or his mother shall surely be put to death," and any death mentioned in the Torah without specification is only strangulation.

hebrew_text: אֵימָא עַד דְּקָטֵיל לֵיהּ מִיקְטָל סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ קְטַל חַד בְּסַיִיף וְאָבִיו בְּחֶנֶק
human_translation: Say unless he kills him enter your mind kills one with a sword, but his father by strangulation?
llm_translation: Mother, until he killed him, your mind was made up to kill him with a sword, and his father by strangulation.

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר חֶנֶק קַל אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר חֶנֶק חָמוּר מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר
human_translation: This works out well according to the one who said strangulation lenient But according to the one who said strangulation severe what is there to say?
llm_translation: He left it for the one who said "light choking." Rather, for the one who said "severe choking," what is there to say?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מִדִּכְתִיב מַכֵּה אִישׁ וָמֵת מוֹת יוּמָת וּכְתִיב אוֹ בְאֵיבָה הִכָּהוּ בְיָדוֹ וַיָּמֹת שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ כֹּל הֵיכָא דְּאִיכָּא הַכָּאָה סְתָם  לָאו מִיתָה הוּא
human_translation: Rather, from that it is written: “One who strikes a man and he dies shall be put to death” and it is written: “Or if in enmity he struck him with his hand and he died Learn from anywhere that there is striking without specifying it is not death.
llm_translation: Rather, from where is it derived? "One who strikes a man so that he dies shall surely be put to death." But it is also written, "Or in enmity he struck him with his hand, and he died." Learn from it: wherever there is striking, it is not necessarily death.

hebrew_text: וְאִיצְטְרִיךְ לְמִיכְתַּב מַכֵּה אִישׁ וְאִיצְטְרִיךְ לְמִכְתַּב כׇּל מַכֵּה נֶפֶשׁ דְּאִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא מַכֵּה אִישׁ וָמֵת הֲוָה אָמֵינָא אִישׁ דְּבַר מִצְוָה  אִין קָטָן  לָא כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא כׇּל מַכֵּה נֶפֶשׁ וְאִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא כׇּל מַכֵּה נֶפֶשׁ הֲוָה אָמֵינָא אֲפִילּוּ נְפָלִים אֲפִילּוּ בֶּן שְׁמוֹנָה צְרִיכִי
human_translation: And it was necessary to write: “One who strikes a man,” and it was necessary to write: “Anyone who kills a soul, since if the Merciful One wrote “One who strikes a man and he dies,” I would say a man, who is obligated in mitzvot, yes, a minor, no, the Merciful One writes: “Anyone who kills a soul.” And if the Merciful One wrote “Anyone who kills a soul,” I would say even a non-viable newborn, or even born after eight are necessary.
llm_translation: And it is necessary to write a law regarding one who strikes a man, and it is necessary to write a law regarding anyone who strikes a soul, for if the Merciful One wrote a law regarding one who strikes a man and he dies, I would say it applies only to an adult who is obligated in commandments; but a minor, the Merciful One did not write a law regarding. Therefore, anyone who strikes a soul, and if the Merciful One did not write a law regarding anyone who strikes a soul, I would say it applies only to those who are standing i.e., adults; even if they are minors, the law applies.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא אַף עַל גַּב דְּלָא עָבֵיד בֵּיהּ חַבּוּרָה אַלְּמָה תְּנַן הַמַּכֶּה אָבִיו וְאִמּוֹ אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב עַד שֶׁיַּעֲשֶׂה בָּהֶן חַבּוּרָה
human_translation: But say even though he did not wound him Why, did we learn One who strikes his father and his mother is not liable unless he wounds them?
llm_translation: And why not, even though he did not actually cause them to be joined, why do we learn that one who strikes his father or mother is not liable until he actually causes them to be joined?

hebrew_text: אָמַר קְרָא מַכֵּה אָדָם וּמַכֵּה בְהֵמָה מָה מַכֵּה בְהֵמָה עַד דְּעָבֵיד בַּהּ חַבּוּרָה דִּכְתִיב בַּהּ נֶפֶשׁ אַף מַכֵּה אָדָם עַד דְּעָבֵיד חַבּוּרָה
human_translation: the verse states: “And one who strikes an animal and one who strikes a person Just as one who strikes an animal unless he wounds it as “soul” is written concerning it, so too, one who strikes a person unless he causes a wound
llm_translation: The verse says: One who strikes a person and one who strikes an animal, what is the law regarding one who strikes an animal? Until he causes it to be blemished, as it is written, "In it the animal there is a soul." Likewise, one who strikes a person, until he causes a blemish.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב יִרְמְיָה אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה הִכְחִישָׁהּ בַּאֲבָנִים הָכִי נָמֵי דְּלָא מִיחַיַּיב אֶלָּא אִם אֵינוֹ עִנְיָן לְנֶפֶשׁ בְּהֵמָה דְּהָא אִי נָמֵי הִכְחִישָׁהּ בַּאֲבָנִים חַיָּיב תְּנֵיהוּ עִנְיָן לְנֶפֶשׁ אָדָם
human_translation: Rav Yirmeya objects to this If that is so, one weakened by stones that so too he is not liable Rather, if it is not a matter to the soul of an animal, as even one weakens by stones liable, apply it to the matter of the soul of a person,
llm_translation: Rav Yirmeya objected to her: Rather, from now on, if she denies it with stones, it is indeed true that he is not liable unless it is a matter concerning the life of an animal. For if, indeed, she denies it with stones, he is liable. Both are a matter concerning the life of a human being.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא הֶקֵּישָׁא לְמָה לִי לְכִדְתַנְיָא דְּבֵי חִזְקִיָּה
human_translation: But why do I juxtaposition for that which is taught in the school of Ḥizkiyya:
llm_translation: Instead, why do I need the comparison to the teaching of the school of Hezekiah?

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לְמַאן דְּאִית לֵיהּ תַּנָּא דְּבֵי חִזְקִיָּה אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּלֵית לֵיהּ תַּנָּא דְּבֵי חִזְקִיָּה הֶיקֵּישָׁא לְמָה לִי
human_translation: This works out well according to the one who holds the tanna of the school of Ḥizkiyya, but according to the one who does not hold the tanna of the school of Ḥizkiyya, why do I juxtaposition
llm_translation: He left it for the one who has a Mishnah from the school of Hizkiyah, but for the one who does not have a Mishnah from the school of Hizkiyah, why do I need it?

hebrew_text: מָה מַכֵּה בְהֵמָה לִרְפוּאָה פָּטוּר  אַף מַכֵּה אָדָם לִרְפוּאָה פָּטוּר
human_translation: just as one who strikes an animal for medical exempt so too, one who strikes a person for medical exempt,
llm_translation: One who strikes an animal for healing is exempt; so too, one who strikes a person for healing is exempt.

hebrew_text: דְּאִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ בֵּן מַהוּ שֶׁיַּקִּיז דָּם לְאָבִיו רַב מַתְנָא אָמַר וְאָהַבְתָּ לְרֵעֲךָ כָּמוֹךָ רַב דִּימִי בַּר חִינָּנָא אָמַר מַכֵּה אָדָם וּמַכֵּה בְהֵמָה מָה מַכֵּה בְהֵמָה לִרְפוּאָה פָּטוּר  אַף מַכֵּה אָדָם לִרְפוּאָה פָּטוּר
human_translation: As a dilemma was raised before What is whether a son may let blood for his father? Rav Mattana says “And you shall love your neighbor as yourself” Rav Dimi bar Ḥinnana says: one who strikes a person and one who strikes an animal. Just as one who strikes an animal for medical exempt so too, one who strikes a person for medical exempt
llm_translation: If one wants to be stringent, what is the law if one wounds his father? Rav Matna said, "Love your neighbor as yourself." Rav Dimi bar Hinana said, "One who strikes a person and strikes an animal, what is the law if one strikes an animal for healing purposes? He is exempt. Likewise, one who strikes a person for healing purposes is exempt."

hebrew_text: רַב לָא שָׁבֵיק לִבְרֵיהּ לְמִישְׁקַל לֵיהּ סִילְוָא מָר בְּרֵיהּ דְּרָבִינָא לָא שָׁבֵיק לִבְרֵיהּ לְמִיפְתַּח לֵיהּ כְּווֹתָא דִּילְמָא חָבֵיל וְהָוְיָא לֵיהּ שִׁגְגַת אִיסּוּר
human_translation: Rav did not allow his son to extract a thorn from him, Mar, son of Ravina, did not allow his son to pierce his blister, lest he wound would be an unwitting a prohibition.
llm_translation: Rav did not leave for his son to weigh for him a large measure of barley. The son of Ravina did not leave for his son to open for him a barrel, lest he make a mistake and it will be a unintentional transgression.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי אַחֵר נָמֵי אַחֵר שִׁיגְגַת לָאו בְּנוֹ שִׁגְגַת חֶנֶק
human_translation: If so, another as well, another unwitting a prohibition. his son unwitting strangulation.
llm_translation: If so, another one, another one, unintentional, not his son, unintentional, strangulation.

hebrew_text: וְהָדִתְנַן מַחַט שֶׁל יָד לִיטּוֹל בָּהּ אֶת הַקּוֹץ לֵיחוּשׁ דִּילְמָא חָבֵיל וְהָוְיָא לַהּ שִׁגְגַת סְקִילָה
human_translation: But which we learned hand needle to extract a thorn with it, Let us be concerned lest he wound would be an unwitting stoning.
llm_translation: And we have learned in a Mishnah: A needle of the hand may be used to remove a thorn, lest one come to carry it, and it will result in a transgression of stoning.

hebrew_text: הָתָם מְקַלְקֵל הוּא
human_translation: There, he is a destructive
llm_translation: There, he is being destructive.

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר מְקַלְקֵל פָּטוּר אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר חַיָּיב מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר
human_translation: This works out well according to the one who said a destructive exempt. But according to the one who said liable what is there to say?
llm_translation: He left it for the one who says "one who damages is exempt," but for the one who says "liable," what can be said?

hebrew_text: מַאן שָׁמְעַתְּ לֵיהּ דְּאָמַר מְקַלְקֵל בְּחַבּוּרָה חַיָּיב  רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן הִיא
human_translation: Whom did you hear that said one who is destructive in a wound liable It is Rabbi Shimon,
llm_translation: One who heard him say, "One who damages in a group is liable," it is Rabbi Shimon's opinion.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן הָאָמַר כׇּל מְלָאכָה שֶׁאֵינָהּ צְרִיכָה לְגוּפָהּ  פָּטוּר עָלֶיהָ
human_translation: and doesn’t Rabbi Shimon say: any labor that is not necessary for its own sake, exempt?
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon said: "Any work that is not necessary for itself, one is exempt from it."

hebrew_text: בְּעוֹ מִינֵּיהּ מֵרַב שֵׁשֶׁת בֵּן מַהוּ שֶׁיֵּעָשֶׂה שָׁלִיחַ לְאָבִיו לְהַכּוֹתוֹ וּלְקִלְּלוֹ
human_translation: raised a dilemma before Rav Sheshet: What is a son may be designated an agent to flog his father or to curse him
llm_translation: He asked from Rav Sheshet: What should one do if his father appoints him as his agent to strike him and curse him?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לְהוּ וְאַחֵר מִי הִתִּירוֹ אֶלָּא כְּבוֹד שָׁמַיִם עָדִיף הָכָא נָמֵי כְּבוֹד שָׁמַיִם עָדִיף
human_translation: said to them: And did permitted another Rather, the honor of Heaven takes precedence Here too, the honor of Heaven takes precedence
llm_translation: He said to them, "And who else permitted it except for the honor of Heaven? Here too, the honor of Heaven is superior."

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי וּמָה מִי שֶׁמִּצְוָה לְהַכּוֹתוֹ מִצְוָה שֶׁלֹּא לְהַכּוֹתוֹ מִי שֶׁאֵינוֹ מִצְוָה לְהַכּוֹתוֹ אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁמִּצְוָה שֶׁלֹּא לְהַכּוֹתוֹ
human_translation: raises an objection And just as who is commanded to strike him a mitzva not to strike him who is not commanded to strike him is it not right that there is a mitzva not to strike him?
llm_translation: The opponent raises an objection: And what if one is commanded to strike him, is it considered a command to strike him, but if one is commanded not to strike him, is it considered not a command to strike him? In response, one who is not commanded to strike him, it is not considered a law that one is commanded not to strike him.

hebrew_text: מַאי לָאו אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי בִּמְקוֹם מִצְוָה הָא בִּבְנוֹ הָא בְּאַחֵר
human_translation: What, is it not this and that to a situation a mitzva, this where his son that where another
llm_translation: What is the reason that both this and that are valid in a place of commandment, this is valid with his son, this is valid with another.

hebrew_text: לָא אִידֵּי וְאִידִי לָא שְׁנָא בְּנוֹ וְלָא שְׁנָא אַחֵר וְלָא קַשְׁיָא כָּאן בִּמְקוֹם מִצְוָה כָּאן שֶׁלֹּא בִּמְקוֹם מִצְוָה
human_translation: No, this and that it is no different his son and it is no different another. And not difficult Here, to a situation a mitzva, there, not to a situation a mitzva.
llm_translation: Not necessary and not necessary not different in his and not different another and not difficult here in a place of commandment here that not in a place of commandment.

hebrew_text: וְהָכִי קָתָנֵי וּמָה בִּמְקוֹם מִצְוָה שֶׁמִּצְוָה לְהַכּוֹתוֹ  מִצְוָה שֶׁלֹּא לְהַכּוֹתוֹ שֶׁלֹּא בִּמְקוֹם מִצְוָה שֶׁאֵינוֹ מִצְוָה לְהַכּוֹתוֹ  אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁמִּצְוָה שֶׁלֹּא לְהַכּוֹתוֹ
human_translation: And this is teaching: And just as in a situation a mitzva, where is commanded to strike him, a mitzva not to strike him in a situation not a mitzva, where one is not commanded to strike him, is it not right that there is a mitzva not to strike him?
llm_translation: And thus it was taught: And what is the law in a place of a commandment that it is a commandment to strike him, but in a place where it is not a commandment to strike him, but in a place of a commandment that it is not a commandment to strike him, it is not the law that it is a commandment to not strike him.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע הַיּוֹצֵא לֵיהָרֵג וּבָא בְּנוֹ וְהִכָּהוּ וְקִילְּלוֹ  חַיָּיב בָּא אַחֵר וְהִכָּהוּ וְקִילְּלוֹ  פָּטוּר וְהָוֵינַן בַּהּ מַאי שְׁנָא בְּנוֹ וּמַאי שְׁנָא אַחֵר וְאָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא בִּמְסָרְבִין בּוֹ לָצֵאת וְאֵינוֹ יוֹצֵא
human_translation: Come hear one who emerges to be executed and his son came and struck him or cursed him, liable another came and struck him or cursed him, exempt. And we discussed it What is different his son and what is different another And Rav Ḥisda says: where they are imploring to emerge but he is not emerging.
llm_translation: Come and hear: one who goes out to be killed, and his son comes and strikes him, and curses him - he is liable. Another one comes and strikes him, and curses him - he is exempt. We were in it: what is the difference between his son and another? Rav Ḥisdah said: We are concerned about him leaving and not leaving.

hebrew_text: רַב שֵׁשֶׁת מוֹקֵי לַהּ בְּשֶׁאֵין מְסָרְבִין בּוֹ לָצֵאת
human_translation: Rav Sheshet interprets where they are not imploring him to emerge
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet strikes her when they do not agree to leave.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי אַחֵר נָמֵי אַחֵר גַּבְרָא קְטִילָא הוּא
human_translation: If so, even another another is a dead man.
llm_translation: If so, another person, another man, is a murderer.

hebrew_text: וְהָאָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת בִּיְּישׁוֹ יָשֵׁן וָמֵת  חַיָּיב הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן  בְּשֶׁהִכָּהוּ הַכָּאָה שֶׁאֵין בָּהּ שָׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה
human_translation: But doesn’t Rav Sheshet say: one humiliates sleeping and dies, liable With what are we dealing here with he struck him a blow that does not have worth one peruta ,
llm_translation: And he said, Rav Sheshet said: "If a person strikes his slave and he dies, he is liable." Here, what are we dealing with? In a case where he struck him with a blow that does not contain a barleycorn's worth of force.

hebrew_text: וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי אַמֵּי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן הִכָּהוּ הַכָּאָה שֶׁאֵין בָּהּ שָׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה  לוֹקֶה מַאי פָּטוּר דְּקָאָמַר פָּטוּר מִמָּמוֹן
human_translation: But doesn’t Rabbi Ami say Rabbi Yoḥanan says: one struck a blow that does not have worth one peruta , he is flogged What exempt that is stated exempt from monetary restitution,
llm_translation: And it was said, Rabbi Ammi said, Rabbi Yochanan said: If one strikes him a blow that does not contain a barley's worth, he is liable. What is the exemption? He is exempt from payment.

hebrew_text: מִכְלָל דִּבְנוֹ חַיָּיב בְּמָמוֹן אֶלָּא בְּדִינוֹ הָכָא נָמֵי בְּדִינוֹ
human_translation: by inference that his son liable monetary restitution. Rather, in accordance with his sentence; here too, in accordance with his sentence.
llm_translation: From the principle that a son is obligated in monetary matters, except in matters of law, here it is stated: in matters of law.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אַחֵר הַיְינוּ טַעְמָא דְּפָטוּר דְּאָמַר קְרָא וְנָשִׂיא בְעַמְּךָ לֹא תָאֹר בְּעוֹשֶׂה מַעֲשֵׂה עַמְּךָ
human_translation: Rather, this is the reason that is exempt: As the verse states: “Nor curse a ruler of your people” with regard to one who performs an action of “your people,”
llm_translation: Rather, another explanation is that this is the reason for being exempt, as the verse says, "And a prince among your people you shall not curse" regarding one who is engaged in the work of your people.

hebrew_text: הָתִינַח קְלָלָה הַכָּאָה מְנָלַן דְּמַקְּשִׁינַן הַכָּאָה לִקְלָלָה
human_translation: This works out well cursing, From where do we striking? as we liken striking to cursing
llm_translation: The curse of striking, from where do we derive that we equate striking to cursing?

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי בְּנוֹ נָמֵי כִּדְאָמַר רַב פִּינְחָס בְּשֶׁעָשָׂה תְּשׁוּבָה הָכִי נָמֵי בְּשֶׁעָשָׂה תְּשׁוּבָה
human_translation: If so, his son too As Rav Pineḥas says where repented, so too, where repented.
llm_translation: So it is, his son is also considered, as Rav Pinchas said, "When he repents, so it is considered as if he repented."

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי אַחֵר נָמֵי אָמַר רַב מָרִי בְּעַמְּךָ  בִּמְקוּיָּם שֶׁבְּעַמְּךָ
human_translation: If so, another as well. Rav Mari says: “of your people” to one enduring among your people,
llm_translation: Thus said Rav Mari: "In your nation, in your place, in your nation."

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי בְּנוֹ נָמֵי
human_translation: If so, his son as well,
llm_translation: If so, then his son is considered valid.

hebrew_text: מִידֵּי דְּהָוֵה לְאַחַר מִיתָה
human_translation: just as it is after death
llm_translation: From the hands of he was to after death

hebrew_text: מַאי הֲוָה עֲלַהּ אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא וְכֵן תָּנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל לַכֹּל אֵין הַבֵּן נַעֲשֶׂה שָׁלִיחַ לְאָבִיו לְהַכּוֹתוֹ וּלְקִלְּלוֹ חוּץ מִמֵּסִית שֶׁהֲרֵי אָמְרָה תּוֹרָה 'וְלֹא תַחְמֹל וְלֹא תְכַסֶּה עָלָיו'
human_translation: What was about Rabba bar Rav Huna says, and likewise the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: With regard to all a son is not designated an agent to strike his father or to curse him, except incites as the Torah states: “Neither shall you spare, nor shall you conceal him”
llm_translation: "What was the case?" Rabba bar Rav Huna said, and similarly it was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael: In all cases, a son does not become an agent to his father to strike him or curse him, except for a rebellious son, as the Torah says, 'And you shall not have pity, nor shall you cover for him.'"

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי' הַמַּכֶּה אָבִיו וְאִמּוֹ אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב עַד שֶׁיַּעֲשֶׂה בָּהֶן חַבּוּרָה זֶה חוֹמֶר בַּמְקַלֵּל מִבַּמַּכֶּה שֶׁהַמְקַלֵּל לְאַחַר מִיתָה  חַיָּיב וְהַמַּכֶּה לְאַחַר מִיתָה  פָּטוּר
human_translation: One who strikes his father or his mother is not liable unless he wounds them. This is a stringency with regard to one who curses than with regard to one who strikes as one who curses after death is liable, but one who strikes after death is exempt,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who strikes his father and mother is not liable until he causes a wound in them. This is a stringency in the case of one who curses, as in the case of one who curses after death, he is liable, whereas one who strikes after death is exempt.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ' תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן 'אָבִיו וְאִמּוֹ קִלֵּל' לְאַחַר מִיתָה שֶׁיָּכוֹל הוֹאִיל וְחִיֵּיב בַּמַּכֶּה וְחִיֵּיב בַּמְקַלֵּל מָה מַכֶּה אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב אֶלָּא מֵחַיִּים  אַף הַמְקַלֵּל אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב אֶלָּא מֵחַיִּים
human_translation: The Sages taught he has cursed his father and his mother; after death, as might Since one is liable for striking and one is liable for cursing, just as one who strikes is liable only when alive, so too, one who curses is liable only when alive.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: "His father and mother he cursed" after death, so that he can be liable for striking and liable for cursing. Just as one who strikes is liable only when the victim is alive, so too, one who curses is liable only when the victim is alive.

hebrew_text: וְעוֹד קַל וָחוֹמֶר וּמָה מַכֶּה שֶׁעָשָׂה בּוֹ שֶׁלֹּא 'בְּעַמְּךָ' כִּ'בְעַמְּךָ' לֹא חִיֵּיב בּוֹ לְאַחַר מִיתָה מְקַלֵּל שֶׁלֹּא עָשָׂה בּוֹ שֶׁלֹּא 'בְּעַמְּךָ' כִּ'בְעַמְּךָ' אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁלֹּא חִיֵּיב בּוֹ לְאַחַר מִיתָה
human_translation: Furthermore, a fortiori If, strikes where deemed not of your people, like of your people, did not deem him liable after death, curses, where deemed not of your people like of your people, is it not right that did not deem him liable after death?
llm_translation: And furthermore, a fortiori, and what about one who strikes another, that he did not do it 'in your people' like 'in your people,' he is not liable for it to result in death. But one who curses another, that he did not do it 'in your people' like 'in your people,' it is not a judgment that he is liable for it to result in death.

hebrew_text: תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר 'אָבִיו וְאִמּוֹ קִלֵּל'  לְאַחַר מִיתָה
human_translation: the verse states “He has cursed his father and his mother,” after death.
llm_translation: The Talmud teaches: "His father and mother he cursed" after death.

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לְרַבִּי יוֹנָתָן דִּמְיַיתַּר לֵיהּ קְרָא אָבִיו וְאִמּוֹ אֶלָּא לְרַבִּי יֹאשִׁיָּה מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר
human_translation: This works out well according to Rabbi Yonatan, for whom the phrase “his father and his mother” is extraneous. But according to Rabbi Yoshiya, what is there to say?
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Hanicha to Rabbi Yonatan, it is more preferable for him, the verse 'his father and his mother' Deuteronomy 27:16. Rather, for Rabbi Yoshiyah, what is there to say?"

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא 'אִישׁ אִישׁ' מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר 'אִישׁ אִישׁ'  לְרַבּוֹת בַּת טוּמְטוּם וְאַנְדְּרוֹגִינוֹס 'אֲשֶׁר יְקַלֵּל אֶת אָבִיו וְאֶת אִמּוֹ' אֵין לִי אֶלָּא אָבִיו וְאִמּוֹ אָבִיו שֶׁלֹּא אִמּוֹ אִמּוֹ שֶׁלֹּא אָבִיו מִנַּיִין  תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר 'אָבִיו וְאִמּוֹ קִלֵּל'  אָבִיו קִלֵּל אִמּוֹ קִלֵּל דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יֹאשִׁיָּה
human_translation: as it is taught any man [ ish ish ] What the verse states “ Ish ish ”? to include a daughter, one whose sexual organs are indeterminate [ tumtum ], and a hermaphrodite “Who curses his father and his mother,” I have only his father and his mother. From where his father who did not his mother, his mother who did not his father? The verse states: “He has cursed his father and his mother,” He cursed his father he cursed his mother. the statement of Rabbi Yoshiya.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: "A man, a man" - what does the Torah come to teach by saying "a man, a man"? To include the daughter of a concealed union and the androgynos who curses his father and his mother. I have only his father and his mother - his father without his mother, his mother without his father, from where do we derive that the Torah comes to say "his father and his mother he cursed"? His father cursed, his mother cursed - these are the words of Rabbi Yoshiyah.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן אוֹמֵר מַשְׁמָע שְׁנֵיהֶן כְּאֶחָד וּמַשְׁמָע אֶחָד וְאֶחָד בִּפְנֵי עַצְמוֹ עַד שֶׁיִּפְרֹט לְךָ הַכָּתוּב 'יַחְדָּיו'
human_translation: Rabbi Yonatan says: indicates both together, and indicates each one by itself, unless the verse specifies “Together,”
llm_translation: Rabbi Yonatan says: Hear both of them as one, and hear one and one separately until the verse "together" is explained to you.

hebrew_text: מְנָא לֵיהּ נָפְקָא לֵיהּ מִוּמְקַלֵּל אָבִיו וְאִמּוֹ מוֹת יוּמָת
human_translation: from where does he He derives it from “And one who curses his father or his mother shall be put to death”
llm_translation: He went out from him who curses his father or his mother, he shall surely be put to death.

hebrew_text: וְאִידַּךְ הַהוּא מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְרַבּוֹת בַּת טוּמְטוּם וְאַנְדְּרוֹגִינוֹס
human_translation: And the other He requires to include a daughter, a tumtum , and a hermaphrodite
llm_translation: And the other one, he brings it to include the daughter of Tumtum and Androgynos.

hebrew_text: וְתִיפּוֹק לֵיהּ מֵאִישׁ אִישׁ דִּבְּרָה תוֹרָה כִּלְשׁוֹן בְּנֵי אָדָם
human_translation: But let him derive from “ ish ish ,” the Torah spoke in the language of people.
llm_translation: And go out to him from man to man spoke Torah like the language of people.

hebrew_text: וְלִיתְנֵי חוֹמֶר בַּמַּכֶּה מִבַּמְקַלֵּל שֶׁהַמַּכֶּה עָשָׂה בּוֹ שֶׁלֹּא בְּעַמְּךָ כִּבְעַמְּךָ מַה שֶּׁאֵין כֵּן בַּמְקַלֵּל קָסָבַר מַקְּשִׁינַן הַכָּאָה לִקְלָלָה
human_translation: And let teach This is a stringency with regard to one who strikes than with regard to one who curses that with regard to one who strikes deemed not of your people like of your people, which is not so with regard to one who curses holds we liken striking to cursing
llm_translation: And to compare a case of one who strikes with one who curses: the one who strikes did something to him that was not like your people as your people, whereas the one who curses holds that we equate a blow to a curse.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא הָנֵי תַּנָּאֵי כְּהָנֵי תַּנָּאֵי דְּתָנֵי חֲדָא כּוּתִי אַתָּה מְצֻוֶּוה עַל הַכָּאָתוֹ וְאִי אַתָּה מְצֻוֶּוה עַל קִלְלָתוֹ וְתַנְיָא אִידַּךְ אִי אַתָּה מְצֻוֶּוה לֹא עַל קִלְלָתוֹ וְלֹא עַל הַכָּאָתוֹ
human_translation: Let us say these tanna’im are parallel to those tanna’im , as it is taught one a Samaritan, you are commanded striking him, but you are not commanded cursing him. And it is taught another You are commanded neither cursing him nor striking him.
llm_translation: Let us say, these Tannaim are like Kohanim, for one teaches a Kutite: "You are commanded regarding his offering, and if you are commanded regarding his curse." And another teaches: "If you are commanded, it is not regarding his curse, nor regarding his offering."

hebrew_text: סַבְרוּהָ דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא כּוּתִים גֵּירֵי אֱמֶת הֵן מַאי לָאו בְּהָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי דְּמָר סָבַר מַקְּשִׁינַן הַכָּאָה לִקְלָלָה וּמָר סָבַר לָא מַקְּשִׁינַן הַכָּאָה לִקְלָלָה
human_translation: assumed everyone, Samaritans are true converts. What, is it not they disagree about this: That Sage, holds we liken striking to cursing and Sage, holds we do not liken striking to cursing,
llm_translation: They thought that all nations are like Kutim, converts of truth. What then? Why did he not agree with this? For Mar thought we should be strict here for a curse, and Mar thought we should not be strict here for a curse.

hebrew_text: לָא דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא מַקְּשִׁינַן הַכָּאָה לִקְלָלָה וְהָכָא בְּהָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי מָר סָבַר כּוּתִים גֵּירֵי אֱמֶת הֵן וּמָר סָבַר כּוּתִים גֵּירֵי אֲרָיוֹת הֵן
human_translation: No, everyone, we do not liken striking to cursing, and here they disagree about this: Sage, holds Samaritans are true converts And Sage, holds Samaritans are converts due to lions
llm_translation: Not all the world, we do not ask here for a curse, and here in this case, our master disputes: one opinion holds that the Kutim are converts of truth, and one opinion holds that the Kutim are converts of lions.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי הַיְינוּ דְּקָתָנֵי עֲלַהּ וְשׁוֹרוֹ כְּיִשְׂרָאֵל אֶלָּא שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ בְּהֶיקֵּישָׁא פְּלִיגִי שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ
human_translation: If so, that which is taught with regard to And his ox like a Jew? Rather, learn from it disagree with regard to the juxtaposition Conclude from it
llm_translation: Thus, is this what is taught: regarding his leaf and his ox, like Israel, except hear from it in comparison, they differ, hear from it.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי' הַגּוֹנֵב נֶפֶשׁ  מִיִּשְׂרָאֵל אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב עַד שֶׁיַּכְנִיסֶנּוּ לִרְשׁוּתוֹ רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר עַד שֶׁיַּכְנִיסֶנּוּ לִרְשׁוּתוֹ וְיִשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ בּוֹ שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וְהִתְעַמֵּר בּוֹ וּמְכָרוֹ הַגּוֹנֵב אֶת בְּנוֹ רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בְּנוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן בְּרוֹקָה מְחַיֵּיב וַחֲכָמִים פּוֹטְרִין גָּנַב מִי שֶׁחֶצְיוֹ עֶבֶד וְחֶצְיוֹ בֶּן חוֹרִין רַבִּי יְהוּדָה מְחַיֵּיב וַחֲכָמִים פּוֹטְרִין
human_translation: One who abducts a Jewish person is not liable unless he brings into his domain. Rabbi Yehuda says: unless he brings him into his domain and exploits him, as it is stated: and he exploited him and sold him, one who abducts his son Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Beroka, deems liable, and the Rabbis deem exempt. one abducted one who is a half-slave half-freeman, Rabbi Yehuda deems liable, and the Rabbis deem exempt.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who steals a soul from a Jew is not liable until he brings it into his domain. Rabbi Yehuda says: Not liable until he brings it into his domain and makes use of it, as it is stated: "And he shall be found in his possession" (Exodus 22:3). The one who steals his son, Rabbi Yishmael, the son of Rabbi Yochanan ben Brokah, deems him liable, while the Sages exempt him. If one steals a thief whose half is a slave and half is free, Rabbi Yehuda deems him liable, while the Sages exempt him.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ' וְתַנָּא קַמָּא לָא בָּעֵי עִימּוּר אָמַר רַבִּי אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרָבָא עִימּוּר פָּחוֹת מִשָּׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ
human_translation: And does the first tanna not require exploitation Rabbi Aḥa, son of Rava, says: between them exploitation less than the value of one peruta .
llm_translation: Gemara: And a Tanna stated in the first part: He does not require Imur. Rabbi Acha, son of Rava, said: Imur is less than a Prutah. There is a distinction between them.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה גְּנָבוֹ וּמְכָרוֹ יָשֵׁן מַהוּ מָכַר אִשָּׁה לְעוּבָּרָהּ מַהוּ יֵשׁ דֶּרֶךְ עִימּוּר בְּכָךְ אוֹ אֵין דֶּרֶךְ עִימּוּר בְּכָךְ
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya raises a dilemma: one abducted and sold him asleep, what is sold woman for her fetus, what is Is that a manner of exploitation or is that not a manner of exploitation
llm_translation: The request of Rabbi Yirmiyah: If one stole and sold an item and it became old, what is the law? If a woman sells her fetus, what is the law? Is there a way to effect a transaction in this manner or is there no way to effect a transaction in this manner?

hebrew_text: וְתִיפּוֹק לֵיהּ דְּלֵיכָּא עִימּוּר כְּלָל לָא צְרִיכָא יָשֵׁן  דִּזְגָא עֲלֵיהּ אִשָּׁה  דְּאוֹקְמַהּ בְּאַפֵּי זִיקָא דֶּרֶךְ עִימּוּר בְּכָךְ אוֹ אֵין דֶּרֶךְ עִימּוּר בְּכָךְ מַאי תֵּיקוּ
human_translation: But let him derive as there is no exploitation at all No, necessary sleeping where one reclines on him, woman where one stands her in the face of the wind is that a manner of exploitation or is that not a manner of exploitation What shall stand [ teiku ]
llm_translation: And it should come out that there is no mixture at all, it is not necessary, a woman who is sleeping on it, that she was established in the anger of the husband, the way of mixture in this manner or not the way of mixture in this manner, what is the resolution.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן 'כִּי יִמָּצֵא אִישׁ גֹּנֵב נֶפֶשׁ מֵאֶחָיו' אֵין לִי אֶלָּא אִישׁ שֶׁגָּנַב אִשָּׁה מִנַּיִין  תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר 'וְגֹנֵב אִישׁ'
human_translation: The Sages taught “If a man shall be found abducting a person of his brethren I have only a man who abducted From where a woman the verse states: And one who abducts a man,
llm_translation: The Sages taught: "When a man is found kidnapping a person from among his brothers" - I only have a man who kidnaps a woman, from where do I derive it? The Torah teaches: "And kidnaps a man."

hebrew_text: אֵין לִי אֶלָּא אִישׁ שֶׁגָּנַב בֵּין אִשָּׁה וּבֵין אִישׁ וְאִשָּׁה שֶׁגָּנְבָה אִישׁ אִשָּׁה שֶׁגָּנְבָה אִשָּׁה מִנַּיִין  תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר 'וּמֵת הַגַּנָּב הַהוּא'  מִכׇּל מָקוֹם
human_translation: I have only a man who abducted whether a man or a woman, And a woman who abducted a man From where a woman who abducted a woman the verse states: “Then that abductor shall die” in any case,
llm_translation: I have only a man who stole, whether from a woman or from a man, and a woman who stole, from where in the Talmud to say 'and the thief shall die' from any place.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא אִידַּךְ 'כִּי יִמָּצֵא אִישׁ גֹּנֵב נֶפֶשׁ מֵאֶחָיו'  אֶחָד הַגּוֹנֵב אֶת הָאִישׁ וְאֶחָד הַגּוֹנֵב אֶת הָאִשָּׁה וְאֶחָד גֵּר וְאֶחָד עֶבֶד מְשׁוּחְרָר וְקָטָן  חַיָּיב גְּנָבוֹ וְלֹא מְכָרוֹ מְכָרוֹ וַעֲדַיִין יֶשְׁנוֹ בִּרְשׁוּתוֹ  פָּטוּר מְכָרוֹ לְאָבִיו אוֹ לְאָחִיו אוֹ לְאֶחָד מִן הַקְּרוֹבִים  חַיָּיב הַגּוֹנֵב אֶת הָעֲבָדִים  פָּטוּר
human_translation: It is taught another “If a man is found abducting a person of his brethren,” whether he abducts a man, or he abducts a woman, or a convert, or an emancipated slave or a minor, liable. abducted but did not sell him, sold him but he remains in his domain, exempt. sold him to father of or to his brother, or to one of relatives, liable. One who abducts slaves is exempt.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: "When a man is found kidnapping a person from among his brothers" - one kidnaps a man, and one kidnaps a woman, and one kidnaps a convert, and one kidnaps a freed slave, and one kidnaps a minor - the kidnapper is liable for his theft. If he sold him, and he is still in his possession, he is exempt. If he sold him, and he is no longer in his possession, he must return the sale to his father, or his brother, or one of his close relatives. The kidnapper is liable for kidnapping slaves, but he is exempt.

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי תַּנָּא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב שֵׁשֶׁת אֲמַר לֵיהּ אֲנִי שׁוֹנֶה רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר 'מֵאֶחָיו' עַד שֶׁיּוֹצִיאֶנּוּ מֵרְשׁוּת אֶחָיו  וְאַתְּ אָמְרַתְּ חַיָּיב תְּנִי פָּטוּר
human_translation: A tanna recited before Rav Sheshet. said to him: I teach Rabbi Shimon says: “of his brethren” unless he removes from the domain of his brethren, and you say liable? teach exempt.
llm_translation: The Tanna taught before Rav Sheshet: Rabbi Shimon says, "From his brothers" - until he removes him from the domain of his brothers. And you say he is liable, teach that he is exempt.

hebrew_text: מַאי קוּשְׁיָא דִּילְמָא הָא רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן הָא רַבָּנַן
human_translation: What the difficulty Perhaps that Rabbi Shimon, this the Rabbis,
llm_translation: What is the question? Perhaps this: Rabbi Shimon or the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: לָא סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן סְתָם מַתְנִיתִין רַבִּי מֵאִיר סְתַם תּוֹסֶפְתָּא רַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה סְתַם סִפְרָא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה סְתַם סִפְרֵי רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן וְכוּלְּהוּ אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא
human_translation: not enter your mind, as Rabbi Yoḥanan says: An unattributed mishna Rabbi Meir; an unattributed Tosefta Rabbi Neḥemya; an unattributed Sifra , Rabbi Yehuda; an unattributed Sifrei Rabbi Shimon. And all of these are in accordance with of Rabbi Akiva,
llm_translation: It did not enter your mind that Rabbi Yochanan said: A stam Mishnah is the opinion of Rabbi Meir, a stam Tosefta is the opinion of Rabbi Nechemiah, a stam Sifra is the opinion of Rabbi Yehuda, a stam Sifrei is the opinion of Rabbi Shimon, and all of them are in accordance with the view of Rabbi Akiva.

hebrew_text: הַגּוֹנֵב בְּנוֹ מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבָּנַן
human_translation: one who abducts his son. What is the reason of the Rabbis,
llm_translation: The one who steals his son, what is the reason of the Rabbis?

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי דְּאָמַר קְרָא כִּי יִמָּצֵא פְּרָט לְמָצוּי
human_translation: Abaye said: from the verse states: “If shall be found exclude found
llm_translation: Abbaye said: as the verse says, "when a specific is found for the general."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב פָּפָּא לְאַבָּיֵי אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה כִּי יִמָּצֵא אִישׁ שֹׁכֵב עִם אִשָּׁה בְעֻלַת בַּעַל הָכִי נָמֵי כִּי יִמָּצֵא  פְּרָט לְמָצוּי כְּגוֹן שֶׁל בֵּית פְּלוֹנִי דִּשְׁכִיחָן גַּבַּיְיהוּ הָכִי נָמֵי דִּפְטִירִי
human_translation: Rav Pappa said to Abaye: If that is so, “If a man shall be found lying with a woman married to a husband, also “If shall be found,” exclude found. So too, that are exempt for example, the house of so-and-so, where are commonly
llm_translation: Rav Papa said to Abbaye: Rather, from now on, when a man is found lying with a woman in the act of adultery, it is indeed as if he has found a specific instance, such as that of the household of Ploni, whose actions are well known, so it is indeed as if they have been acquitted.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אֲנָא מִוְנִמְצָא בְּיָדוֹ קָאָמֵינָא
human_translation: said to “Or if he is found in his possession, I am saying
llm_translation: He said to him: "I am found in his hand," I am saying.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא הִלְכָּךְ הָנֵי מַיקְרֵי דַרְדְּקֵי וּמַתְנוּ רַבָּנַן כִּמְצוּיִין בְּיָדָן דָּמוּ וּפְטִירִי
human_translation: Rava said: Therefore, those teachers of children [ dardekei ] and those who recite to Torah scholars, is as found in their possession, and are exempt
llm_translation: Rava said: Therefore, those bundles of herbs are considered as if they are already in their possession, and the Rabbis concede to them. They are like those that are already in their hands, they are valid and exempt.

hebrew_text: גָּנַב מִי שֶׁחֶצְיוֹ וְכוּ' תְּנַן הָתָם רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר אֵין לַעֲבָדִים בּוֹשֶׁת
human_translation: one abducted one who is half-slave We learned there Rabbi Yehuda says: There is no humiliation of a slave,
llm_translation: Theft from one who is half and so on. We learned there: Rabbi Yehuda says, "Slaves have no shame."

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אָמַר קְרָא כִּי יִנָּצוּ אֲנָשִׁים יַחְדָּו אִישׁ וְאָחִיו מִי שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ אַחְוָה יָצָא עֶבֶד שֶׁאֵין לוֹ אַחְוָה
human_translation: What is the reason of Rabbi Yehuda? the verse states: “When men struggle together, a man and his brother, one who has brotherhood, A slave is excluded, as he has no brotherhood,
llm_translation: What is the reason for Rabbi Yehuda's statement? He said: "The verse states, 'When men strive together, one with another, and the wife of the one draws near to deliver her husband out of the hand of him that smiteth him, and putteth forth her hand, and taketh him by the secrets' (Deuteronomy 25:11). If he has a brother, he is exempt; if he is a slave and has no brother, he is liable."

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן אָחִיו הוּא בְּמִצְוֹת
human_translation: And the Rabbis? is the brother of with regard to mitzvot,
llm_translation: And the Rabbis, his brothers, he is in commandments.

hebrew_text: וְהָכָא הֵיכִי דָּרֵישׁ רַבִּי יְהוּדָה
human_translation: And here, how does Rabbi Yehuda interpret
llm_translation: And here, how did Rabbi Yehuda interpret...

hebrew_text: סָבַר מֵאֶחָיו  לְאַפּוֹקֵי עֲבָדִים בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל  לְמַעוֹטֵי מִי שֶׁחֶצְיוֹ עֶבֶד וְחֶצְיוֹ בֶּן חוֹרִין מִבְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל  לְמַעוֹטֵי מִי שֶׁחֶצְיוֹ עֶבֶד וְחֶצְיוֹ בֶּן חוֹרִין הָוֵי מִיעוּט אַחַר מִיעוּט וְאֵין מִיעוּט אַחַר מִיעוּט אֶלָּא לְרַבּוֹת
human_translation: holds “From his brethren” to exclude slaves. The children of Israel, to exclude one who is half-slave half-freeman. “From the children of Israel,” to exclude one who is half-slave half-freeman. this is a restriction following a restriction, and a restriction following a restriction only to amplify
llm_translation: He thought from his brothers to go out to work slaves sons of Israel to exclude who his half slave and half free from sons of Israel to exclude who his half slave and half free is considered an exclusion after an exclusion and an exclusion after an exclusion is only to include.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן מֵאֶחָיו לְאַפּוֹקֵי עֲבָדִים לָא מַשְׁמַע לְהוּ דְּהָא אָחִיו הוּא בְּמִצְוֹת בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל מִבְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל חַד לְמַעוֹטֵי עֶבֶד וְחַד לְמַעוֹטֵי מִי שֶׁחֶצְיוֹ עֶבֶד וְחֶצְיוֹ בֶּן חוֹרִין
human_translation: And the Rabbis, They do not exclude slaves “from his brethren,” as is the brother of with regard to the mitzvot. “children of Israel” “from the children of Israel,” one to exclude slaves, and one to exclude one who is half-slave half-freeman.
llm_translation: The sages from his brothers regarding the redemption of slaves do not agree with them, for his brother is included in the commandments of the children of Israel from the children of Israel, one to exclude a slave and one to exclude one whose half is a slave and half is free.

hebrew_text: אַזְהָרָה לְגוֹנֵב נֶפֶשׁ מִנַּיִן רַבִּי יֹאשִׁיָּה אָמַר מִלֹּא תִגְנֹב רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר מִלֹּא יִמָּכְרוּ מִמְכֶּרֶת עֶבֶד וְלָא פְּלִיגִי מָר קָא חָשֵׁיב לָאו דִּגְנֵיבָה וּמָר קָא חָשֵׁיב לָאו דִּמְכִירָה
human_translation: From where a prohibition against abducting a person Rabbi Yoshiya says from “You shall not steal” Rabbi Yoḥanan says from “They shall not be sold as slaves” And they do not disagree, Sage, enumerates prohibition against abduction, and Sage, enumerates prohibition against selling
llm_translation: Warning for one who steals a soul - from where? Rabbi Yoshiyah said: "Do not steal." Rabbi Yochanan said: "Do not sell with the sale of a slave." And the Master does not differentiate, for one Master considers it not as theft, and the other Master considers it not as a sale.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן 'לֹא תִגְנֹב'  בְּגוֹנֵב נְפָשׁוֹת הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר אַתָּה אוֹמֵר בְּגוֹנֵב נְפָשׁוֹת אוֹ אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא בְּגוֹנֵב מָמוֹן אָמַרְתָּ צֵא וּלְמַד מִשְּׁלֹשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה מִדּוֹת שֶׁהַתּוֹרָה נִדְרֶשֶׁת בָּהֶן דָּבָר הַלָּמֵד מֵעִנְיָינוֹ בְּמָה הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר  בִּנְפָשׁוֹת אַף כָּאן בִּנְפָשׁוֹת
human_translation: The Sages taught “You shall not steal” with regard to abducts people the verse is speaking. Do you say with regard to abducts people, or only with regard to steals property? You say: Go out and learn from the thirteen hermeneutical principles: A matter derived from its context. With regard to what the verse speaking? with regard to capital So too here, with regard to a capital
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: "You shall not steal." When the verse speaks of a thief of souls, do you say it refers to one who steals souls, or is it rather referring to one who steals money? You have said, "Go out and learn from the thirteen principles through which the Torah is expounded. Just as in the case of one who learns from his own situation, in what context is the verse speaking? Just as there it is speaking of souls, so too here it is speaking of souls."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא אִידַּךְ 'לֹא תִגְנֹבוּ' בְּגוֹנֵב מָמוֹן הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר אַתָּה אוֹמֵר בְּגוֹנֵב מָמוֹן אוֹ אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא בְּגוֹנֵב נְפָשׁוֹת אָמַרְתָּ צֵא וּלְמַד מִשְּׁלֹשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה מִדּוֹת שֶׁהַתּוֹרָה נִדְרֶשֶׁת בָּהֶן דָּבָר הַלָּמֵד מֵעִנְיָנוֹ בְּמָה הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר  בְּמָמוֹן אַף כָּאן בְּמָמוֹן
human_translation: It is taught another “You shall not steal” with regard to steals property the verse is speaking. Do you say with regard to steals property, or only with regard to abducts people? You say: Go out and learn from the thirteen hermeneutical principles: A matter derived from its context. With regard to what is the verse: speaking? with regard to property. So too here, with regard to property.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: "You shall not steal." With regard to one who steals money, the verse is speaking. You might say, with regard to one who steals money or not, rather with regard to one who steals souls you said. Go out and learn from the thirteen principles through which the Torah is expounded, in what context is the verse speaking? Just as in the case of money, so too here, with regard to money.

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר עֵידֵי גְנֵיבָה וְעֵידֵי מְכִירָה בְּנֶפֶשׁ שֶׁהוּזַּמּוּ חִזְקִיָּה אָמַר אֵין נֶהֱרָגִין רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר נֶהֱרָגִין
human_translation: It was stated: the witnesses to the abduction and the witnesses to the sale of a person were rendered conspiring witnesses, Ḥizkiyya says: they are not executed. Rabbi Yoḥanan says: They are executed.
llm_translation: It was stated: Witnesses for theft and witnesses for a sale in a capital case where Hezekiah testified, Zechariah said: They are not killed. Rabbi Yochanan said: They are killed.

hebrew_text: חִזְקִיָּה דְּאָמַר כְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא דְּאָמַר דָּבָר וְלֹא חֲצִי דָּבָר וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר כְּרַבָּנַן דְּאָמְרִי דָּבָר וַאֲפִילּוּ חֲצִי דָּבָר
human_translation: Ḥizkiyya who said in accordance with Rabbi Akiva, who said matter, but not half a matter. And Rabbi Yoḥanan says in accordance with the Rabbis, who said matter, and even half a matter.
llm_translation: Hezekiah said in the name of Rabbi Akiva who said a matter and not half a matter, and Rabbi Yochanan said in the name of the Sages who said a matter even half a matter.

hebrew_text: וּמוֹדֶה חִזְקִיָּה בְּעֵדִים הָאַחֲרוֹנִים שֶׁל בֶּן סוֹרֵר וּמוֹרֶה שֶׁהוּזַּמּוּ שֶׁנֶּהֱרָגִין מִתּוֹךְ שֶׁיְּכוֹלִים לוֹמַר הָרִאשׁוֹנִים
human_translation: And Ḥizkiyya concedes with regard to the final witnesses of a stubborn and rebellious son who were rendered conspiring witnesses that they are executed. as the first could say:
llm_translation: And Hizkiyah concedes regarding the latter witnesses of a wayward son, and a teacher, that they were plotted against, who are put to death, because the former ones could say, "The first ones."

hebrew_text: לְהַלְקוֹתוֹ בָּאנוּ וְהָנֵי אַחֲרִינֵי  כּוּלֵּי[הּ] דָּבָר קָא עָבְדִי לֵיהּ
human_translation: to flog him, we came And these other did to him, entire matter
llm_translation: To strike him we came, and those others after him, all of them did the same thing to him.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב פָּפָּא אִי הָכִי עֵידֵי מְכִירָה נָמֵי לִיקְטְלֵיהּ מִתּוֹךְ שֶׁיְּכוֹלִין עֵידֵי גְנֵיבָה לוֹמַר לְהַלְקוֹתוֹ בָּאנוּ וְכִי תֵּימָא דְּקָסָבַר חִזְקִיָּה דְּלָא לָקֵי
human_translation: Rav Pappa objects to this: If so, let them also execute the witnesses to the sale as the witnesses to the abduction could say: to flog we came And if you would say that Ḥizkiyya holds that is not flogged,
llm_translation: Rav Papa objects to her: If so, the witnesses of recognition should also be killed, since the witnesses of theft could say, "We came to flog him." And if you will say that Hezekiah holds that one does not flog...

hebrew_text: וְהָא אִיתְּמַר עֵידֵי גְּנֵיבָה בְּנֶפֶשׁ שֶׁהוּזַּמּוּ חִזְקִיָּה וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן חַד אָמַר לוֹקִין וְחַד אָמַר אֵין לוֹקִין וְאָמְרִינַן תִּסְתַּיֵּים דְּחִזְקִיָּה דְּאָמַר לוֹקִין מִדְּאָמַר חִזְקִיָּה אֵין נֶהֱרָגִין
human_translation: But wasn’t it stated: witnesses to the abduction who were rendered conspiring witnesses Ḥizkiyya and Rabbi Yoḥanan One says: They are flogged, and one says: They are not flogged. And we say: It may be concluded that Ḥizkiyya who said they are flogged, from that Ḥizkiyya said: They are not executed.
llm_translation: And this was said in the case of witnesses in a theft involving a life, where Hezekiah and Rabbi Yochanan testified. One said they are lashed, and one said they are not lashed. And we say: the matter is concluded according to Hezekiah, as Hezekiah said they are lashed, therefore they are not killed.

hebrew_text: דְּאִי רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן כֵּיוָן דְּאָמַר נֶהֱרָגִין הָוֵה לֵיהּ לָאו שֶׁנִּיתַּן לְאַזְהָרַת מִיתַת בֵּית דִּין וְכׇל לָאו שֶׁנִּיתַּן לְאַזְהָרַת מִיתַת בֵּית דִּין אֵין לוֹקִין עָלָיו אִיהוּ לָא לָקֵי אִינְהוּ הֵיכִי לָקוּ
human_translation: Since if Rabbi Yoḥanan Since he says are executed it is a prohibition that is given as a warning a court death and any prohibition that is given as a warning a court death one is not flogged for its is not flogged. How could be flogged
llm_translation: If Rabbi Yochanan, since he said that those who are killed, it is considered as if they were not given over to the warning of the court's death penalty, and any prohibition that is given over to the warning of the court's death penalty, one does not receive lashes for it, how do they receive lashes?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא בְּעֵידֵי מְכִירָה דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דְּנֶהֱרָגִין כִּי פְּלִיגִי בְּעֵידֵי גְנֵיבָה חִזְקִיָּה אָמַר אֵין נֶהֱרָגִין גְּנֵיבָה לְחוֹדַהּ קָיְימָא וּמְכִירָה לְחוּדַהּ קָיְימָא רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר נֶהֱרָגִין גְּנֵיבָה אַתְחַלְתָּא דִמְכִירָה הִיא
human_translation: Rather, Rav Pappa says: With regard to the witnesses to the sale that everyone agrees that they are executed, When they disagree, with regard to the witnesses to the abduction. Ḥizkiyya says: They are not executed, abduction stands discrete and sale stands discrete Rabbi Yoḥanan says: They are executed, abduction is the beginning of the sale.
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Papa said: In cases of recognition, which are universally known, they do not argue, for when they do argue, it is in cases of theft. Hezekiah said: In cases of theft, they are not put to death, for theft is established by itself, and recognition is established by itself. Rabbi Yochanan said: They are put to death for theft, as it is a precursor to recognition.

hebrew_text: וּמוֹדֶה רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בְּעֵדִים הָרִאשׁוֹנִים שֶׁל בֵּן סוֹרֵר וּמוֹרֶה שֶׁהוּזַּמּוּ שֶׁאֵין נֶהֱרָגִין מִתּוֹךְ שֶׁיְּכוֹלִין לוֹמַר לְהַלְקוֹתוֹ בָּאנוּ
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan concedes with regard to the initial witnesses concerning a stubborn and rebellious son who were rendered conspiring witnesses that they are not executed, as they could say: to flog him we came
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan concedes regarding the initial witnesses of a wayward son and a rebellious teacher who were proven to be conspiring, that they are not put to death, since they could still say, "We came to rebuke him."

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי הַכֹּל מוֹדִים בְּבֵן סוֹרֵר וּמוֹרֶה וְהַכֹּל מוֹדִים בְּבֵן סוֹרֵר וּמוֹרֶה וּמַחְלוֹקֶת בְּבֵן סוֹרֵר וּמוֹרֶה
human_translation: Abaye said All concede in a stubborn and rebellious son, and all concede in a stubborn and rebellious son, and a dispute with regard to a stubborn and rebellious son.
llm_translation: Abaye said: Everyone agrees regarding a wayward and rebellious son, and everyone agrees regarding a wayward and rebellious son, and there is a dispute regarding a wayward and rebellious son.

hebrew_text: הַכֹּל מוֹדִים בְּבֵן סוֹרֵר וּמוֹרֶה בְּעֵדִים הָרִאשׁוֹנִים שֶׁאֵין נֶהֱרָגִין מִתּוֹךְ שֶׁיְּכוֹלִין לוֹמַר לְהַלְקוֹתוֹ בָּאנוּ
human_translation: With regard to the initial witnesses, all, concede in a stubborn and rebellious son that they are not executed as they could say: to flog him we came
llm_translation: All agree regarding a wayward son and a rebellious elder, with the testimony of the initial witnesses, that they are not put to death unless they are able to say, "We have come to have him stoned."

hebrew_text: וְהַכֹּל מוֹדִים בְּבֵן סוֹרֵר וּמוֹרֶה  בְּעֵדִים אַחֲרוֹנִים שֶׁנֶּהֱרָגִים מִתּוֹךְ שֶׁעֵדִים הָרִאשׁוֹנִים יְכוֹלִין לוֹמַר לְהַלְקוֹתוֹ בָּאנוּ וְהָנֵי כּוּלֵּיהּ דָּבָר קָא עָבְדִי לֵיהּ
human_translation: And with regard to the final witnesses, all, concede in a stubborn and rebellious son that they are executed due to that the initial witnesses could say: to flog him we came and did to him, entire matter
llm_translation: And all agree regarding a wayward and rebellious son, and witnesses who were later found to be false, who were put to death because of the first witnesses, the latter can say to have him flogged, "We have come." And all of this was done for his benefit.

hebrew_text: וּמַחְלוֹקֶת בְּבֵן סוֹרֵר וּמוֹרֶה שְׁנַיִם אוֹמְרִים בְּפָנֵינוּ גָּנַב וּשְׁנַיִם אוֹמְרִים בְּפָנֵינוּ אָכַל
human_translation: And there is a dispute with regard to a stubborn and rebellious son two say: He stole in our presence, and two say: He ate in our presence.
llm_translation: Dispute in the case of a wayward son and a rebellious son: two say he stole in our presence, and two say he ate in our presence.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אַסִּי עֵדֵי מְכִירָה בְּנֶפֶשׁ שֶׁהוּזַּמּוּ  אֵין נֶהֱרָגִין מִתּוֹךְ שֶׁיָּכוֹל לוֹמַר עַבְדִּי מָכַרְתִּי
human_translation: Rav Asi says: The witnesses to the sale of a person who were rendered conspiring witnesses are not executed, due to that could say: my slave I sold.
llm_translation: Rav Assi said: Witnesses of recognition in a case where they were proven to be conspiring, they are not executed, because they can say, "My servant, I have sold."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף כְּמַאן אָזְלָא הָא שְׁמַעְתָּא דְּרַב אַסִּי  כְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא דְּאָמַר דָּבָר וְלֹא חֲצִי דָבָר אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי דְּאִי כְּרַבָּנַן נֶהֱרָגִין הָא מִתּוֹךְ קָאָמַר
human_translation: Rav Yosef says: In accordance with whose opinion is that halakha of Rav Asi? in accordance with Rabbi Akiva, who says: matter and not half a matter. Abaye said to as, if in accordance with the Rabbis, executed? Doesn’t say due to
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: To whom does this teaching of Rav Assi go according to? Like Rabbi Akiva who said a matter and not half a matter. Abbaye said to him: If like the Rabbis, they are killed, but this is said in the midst of a teaching.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבָּנַן וּבִדְלָא אֲתוֹ עֵידֵי גְּנֵיבָה אִי הָכִי מַאי לְמֵימְרָא לָא צְרִיכָא דְּאַף עַל גַּב דַּאֲתוֹ לְבַסּוֹף
human_translation: Rather, you even say the Rabbis, and where witnesses to the abduction did not come If so, what of stating No, necessary that even if ultimately came
llm_translation: Rather, even if you say they are sages and they did not come to testify about theft, if so, what can we say? It is not necessary to say that even though they came at the end.

hebrew_text: וְאַכַּתִּי מַאי לְמֵימְרָא לָא צְרִיכָא דְּקָא מְרַמְּזִי רַמּוֹזֵי מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא רְמִיזָא מִילְּתָא הִיא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן רְמִיזָא לָאו כְּלוּם הוּא
human_translation: But still, what of stating No, necessary where gesture lest you say: Gesturing is matter, teaches us gesturing is nothing
llm_translation: And thus, what is there to say that it is not necessary, for they are hinting at hints. What is the reason that you might say it is a hint of a matter? It is evident to us that a hint is not nothing.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי' זָקֵן מַמְרֵא עַל פִּי בֵּית דִּין שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר כִּי יִפָּלֵא מִמְּךָ דָבָר לַמִּשְׁפָּט שְׁלֹשָׁה בָּתֵּי דִינִין הָיוּ שָׁם אֶחָד יוֹשֵׁב עַל פֶּתַח הַר הַבַּיִת וְאֶחָד יוֹשֵׁב עַל פֶּתַח הָעֲזָרָה וְאֶחָד יוֹשֵׁב בְּלִשְׁכַּת הַגָּזִית
human_translation: A rebellious elder according to court, as it is stated: “If there shall be a matter too hard for you in judgment There were three courts there One convenes at the entrance to the Temple Mount, and one convenes at the entrance to the courtyard, and one convenes in the Chamber of Hewn Stone.
llm_translation: It was taught: An elder from Mamre testified before the court, as it is stated, "If a matter is too difficult for you in judgment" (Deuteronomy 17:8). There were three courts there: one sat at the entrance of the Temple Mount, one sat at the entrance of the Temple courtyard, and one sat in the Chamber of Hewn Stone.

hebrew_text: בָּאִין לָזֶה שֶׁעַל פֶּתַח הַר הַבַּיִת וְאוֹמֵר כָּךְ דָּרַשְׁתִּי וְכָךְ דָּרְשׁוּ חֲבֵירַי כָּךְ לִימַּדְתִּי וְכָךְ לִימְּדוּ חֲבֵירַי אִם שָׁמְעוּ  אָמְרוּ לָהֶם
human_translation: come to that that is at the entrance to the Temple Mount, and says: This I interpreted and that my colleagues interpreted; this I taught and that my colleagues taught. If heard says to them.
llm_translation: They come to the courtyard that is at the entrance of the Temple Mount and say, "Thus I have expounded, and thus my colleagues have expounded. Thus I have taught, and thus my colleagues have taught. If they listened, they said to them:"

hebrew_text: וְאִם לָאו  בָּאִין לָהֶן לְאוֹתָן שֶׁעַל פֶּתַח עֲזָרָה וְאוֹמֵר כָּךְ דָּרַשְׁתִּי וְכָךְ דָּרְשׁוּ חֲבֵירַי כָּךְ לִימַּדְתִּי וְכָךְ לִימְּדוּ חֲבֵירַי אִם שׇׁמְעוֹ  אָמְרוּ לָהֶם
human_translation: And if not, they come to those who at the entrance to Temple courtyard, And says: This I interpreted and that my colleagues interpreted; this I taught and that my colleagues taught. If heard says to them.
llm_translation: "And if not, they come to those that are at the entrance of the Azarah and say: Thus I have expounded, and thus my colleagues have expounded, thus I have taught, and thus my colleagues have taught. If they listened, they said to them..."

hebrew_text: וְאִם לָאו אֵלּוּ וָאֵלּוּ בָּאִין לְבֵית דִּין הַגָּדוֹל שֶׁבְּלִשְׁכַּת הַגָּזִית שֶׁמִּמֶּנּוּ יוֹצְאָה תּוֹרָה לְכׇל יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר מִן הַמָּקוֹם הַהוּא אֲשֶׁר יִבְחַר ה' חָזַר לְעִירוֹ שָׁנָה וְלִמֵּד בַּדֶּרֶךְ שֶׁהָיָה לָמֵד פָּטוּר וְאִם הוֹרָה לַעֲשׂוֹת חַיָּיב שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וְהָאִישׁ אֲשֶׁר יַעֲשֶׂה בְזָדוֹן אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב עַד שֶׁיּוֹרֶה לַעֲשׂוֹת
human_translation: And if not, these and those come to the High Court, that is in the Chamber of Hewn Stone, from which Torah emerges to the entire Jewish people, as it is stated: from that place that the Lord shall choose returned to his city, he taught in the manner that he was teaching exempt But if he instructed to act liable as it is stated: “And the man that shall do so intentionally one is not liable unless he instructs to act.
llm_translation: And if not, these and these come to the Great Court in the Chamber of the Hewn Stone, from which Torah emanates to all of Israel, as it is stated: "From that place that the Lord will choose, he shall return to his city after a year, and he shall teach in the way that he had learned, he is exempt. But if he teaches to act, he is liable, as it is stated: 'But the man who acts presumptuously shall not listen to the priest who stands to minister there before the Lord your God, or to the judge, that man shall die.'"

hebrew_text: תַּלְמִיד שֶׁהוֹרָה לַעֲשׂוֹת  פָּטוּר נִמְצָא חוּמְרוֹ קוֹלוֹ
human_translation: A student who instructs to act exempt, It follows his stringency is his leniency.
llm_translation: Disciple that teaches to do exempt found his strictness his voice

hebrew_text: גְּמָ' תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן 'כִּי יִפָּלֵא מִמְּךָ דָבָר'
human_translation: The Sages taught “If there shall be a matter too hard [ yippaleh ] for you”;
llm_translation: "Gemara: Tanu Rabbanan, 'Ki yipalei mimecha davar.'"

hebrew_text: בְּמוּפְלָא שֶׁבְּבֵית דִּין הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר 'מִמְּךָ'  זֶה יוֹעֵץ וְכֵן הוּא אוֹמֵר 'מִמֵּךְ יָצָא חֹשֵׁב עַל ה' רָעָה יֹעֵץ בְּלִיַּעַל' 'דָּבָר'  זוֹ הֲלָכָה 'לַמִּשְׁפָּט'  זֶה הַדִּין
human_translation: with regard to the most distinguished [ mufla ] of the court, the verse is speaking. “For you [ mimmekha ]”; this is an adviser, and likewise it says: “From you [ mimmekh ] he emerged, who devised evil against the Lord, an adviser of wickedness” “A matter”; this a halakha “In judgment”; this is a logical inference,
llm_translation: In a wonder that in the court the scripture speaks 'from you' this is a counselor and so it says 'from you came out one who plots evil against the Lord, a worthless counselor' 'word' this is a halakha 'for judgment' this is the law.

hebrew_text: 'בֵּין דָּם לְדָם'  בֵּין דַּם נִדָּה דַּם לֵידָה דַּם זִיבָה 'בֵּין דִּין לְדִין'  בֵּין דִּינֵי נְפָשׁוֹת דִּינֵי מָמוֹנוֹת דִּינֵי מַכּוֹת 'בֵּין נֶגַע לָנֶגַע'  בֵּין נִגְעֵי אָדָם נִגְעֵי בָתִּים נִגְעֵי בְגָדִים
human_translation: “Between blood and blood”; between blood of a menstruating woman, blood of childbirth, blood of discharge [ ziva ]. “Between plea and plea”; between capital law monetary law, laws lashes. “Between mark and mark”; between leprous marks of a person, leprous marks on houses, leprous marks on garments
llm_translation: Between blood and blood, between the blood of menstruation, the blood of childbirth, and the blood of abnormal uterine bleeding. Between judgment and judgment, between the laws of capital cases, the laws of monetary cases, and the laws of corporal punishment. Between affliction and affliction, between afflictions of humans, afflictions of houses, and afflictions of garments.

hebrew_text: 'דִּבְרֵי'  אֵלּוּ הַחֲרָמִים וְהָעֲרָכִין וְהַהֶקְדֵּשׁוֹת 'רִיבֹת'  זוֹ הַשְׁקָאַת סוֹטָה וַעֲרִיפַת עֶגְלָה וְטׇהֳרַת מְצוֹרָע 'בִּשְׁעָרֶיךָ'  זוֹ לֶקֶט שִׁכְחָה וּפֵאָה
human_translation: “Matters of [ divrei ]”; these are the dedications and the valuations and the consecrations, “Controversy”; this is the giving waters to a sota and the heifer whose neck is broken, and the purification of a leper, “Within your gates”; this is gleanings, forgotten and produce in the corner of the field [ pe’a ],
llm_translation: Words: These are the prohibitions, valuations, and consecrations. Ribot: This is the offering of the Sotah, the ashes of the Red Heifer, and the purification of the leper. In your gates: This refers to forgotten sheaves and corners of the field.

hebrew_text: 'וְקַמְתָּ'  מִבֵּית דִּין 'וְעָלִיתָ'  מְלַמֵּד שֶׁבֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ גָּבוֹהַּ מֵאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל וְאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל גָּבוֹהַּ מִכׇּל הָאֲרָצוֹת 'אֶל הַמָּקוֹם' מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהַמָּקוֹם גּוֹרֵם
human_translation: “Then you shall arise” from the court “And ascend”; teaches that the Temple is higher than Eretz Yisrael, and Eretz Yisrael is higher than all lands. “To the place teaches that the location causes
llm_translation: 'And you shall arise' from the court 'and ascend' teaches that the Temple is higher than the land of Israel, and the land of Israel is higher than all other lands 'to the place' teaches that the place causes.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ גָּבוֹהַּ מֵאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל  דִּכְתִיב וְעָלִיתָ אֶלָּא אֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל גָּבוֹהַּ מִכׇּל הָאֲרָצוֹת מְנָא לֵיהּ דִּכְתִיב לָכֵן הִנֵּה יָמִים בָּאִים נְאֻם ה' לֹא יֵאָמֵר חַי ה' אֲשֶׁר הֶעֱלָה אֶת בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל מֵאֶרֶץ מִצְרַיִם כִּי אִם חַי ה' אֲשֶׁר הֶעֱלָה וַאֲשֶׁר הֵבִיא אֶת זֶרַע בֵּית יִשְׂרָאֵל מֵאֶרֶץ צָפֹנָה וּמִכֹּל הָאֲרָצוֹת אֲשֶׁר הִדַּחְתִּים שָׁם וְיָשְׁבוּ עַל אַדְמָתָם
human_translation: Granted, the Temple is higher than Eretz Yisrael as it is written: “And ascend.” But from where Eretz Yisrael is higher than all lands? as it is written: “Therefore, behold, the days come, says the Lord, and they will no longer say: As the Lord lives, Who brought up the children of Israel from the land of Egypt; rather, as the Lord lives, Who brought up and led the descendants of the house of Israel from the north country and from all the countries where I had driven them, and they shall dwell upon their land”
llm_translation: In truth, the Temple is higher than the land of Israel, as it is written, "And you shall ascend." But is the land of Israel higher than all the lands? How do we know this? As it is written, "Therefore, behold, days are coming, says the Lord, when it will no longer be said, 'As the Lord lives, who brought up the children of Israel from the land of Egypt,' but rather, 'As the Lord lives, who brought up and who led the seed of the house of Israel from the land of the north and from all the lands where He had driven them, and they shall dwell on their own soil.'"

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן זָקֵן מַמְרֵא אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב אֶלָּא עַל דָּבָר שֶׁזְּדוֹנוֹ כָּרֵת וְשִׁגְגָתוֹ חַטָּאת דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר עַל דָּבָר שֶׁעִיקָּרוֹ מִדִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה וּפֵירוּשׁוֹ מִדִּבְרֵי סוֹפְרִים  רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר אֲפִילּוּ דִּקְדּוּק אֶחָד מִדִּקְִדּוּקֵי סוֹפְרִים
human_translation: The Sages taught A rebellious elder is liable only for a matter whose intentional karet , and whose unwitting a sin-offering; the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: for a matter whose essence is from the words of the Torah and whose explanation is from rabbinic interpretations Rabbi Shimon says: Even one of the minutiae of the scribes
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: An elder from Ma'arava is liable only for a matter that its intentional violation is punishable by excision, and its unintentional violation is atoned for by a sin-offering. These are the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: For a matter whose essence is from the words of the Torah, but its explanation is from the words of the Scribes. Rabbi Shimon says: Even for one meticulous detail from the meticulous details of the Scribes.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר  גָּמַר דָּבָר דָּבָר כְּתִיב הָכָא כִּי יִפָּלֵא מִמְּךָ דָבָר לַמִּשְׁפָּט וּכְתִיב הָתָם וְנֶעְלַם דָּבָר מֵעֵינֵי הַקָּהָל מָה לְהַלָּן דָּבָר שֶׁחַיָּיב עַל זְדוֹנוֹ כָּרֵת וְעַל שִׁגְגָתוֹ חַטָּאת אַף כָּאן דָּבָר שֶׁחַיָּיב עַל זְדוֹנוֹ כָּרֵת וְעַל שִׁגְגָתוֹ חַטָּאת
human_translation: What is the reason of Rabbi Meir? He derives matter matter Here, is written “If there shall be a matter too hard for you in judgment” and there, it is written: “And the matter shall be concealed from the eyes of the assembly” Just as there, a matter whose intentional karet , and whose unwitting a sin-offering, so too here, a matter whose intentional karet , and whose unwitting a sin-offering.
llm_translation: What is the reason for Rabbi Meir? It is derived from a verse, as it is written here, "For the matter is too extraordinary for you, for judgment," and it is written there, "And the matter is hidden from the eyes of the congregation." Just as there, a matter that one is liable for intentionally results in excision, and for unintentional transgression results in a sin-offering, so too here, a matter that one is liable for intentionally results in excision, and for unintentional transgression results in a sin-offering.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה עַל פִּי הַתּוֹרָה אֲשֶׁר יוֹרוּךָ עַד דְּאִיכָּא תּוֹרָה וְיוֹרוּךָ
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda? “According to the Torah that they shall instruct you” until it is Torah and shall instruct you
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda according to the Torah that they instruct you until there is Torah and they instruct you.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אֲשֶׁר יַגִּידוּ לְךָ מִן הַמָּקוֹם הַהוּא אֲפִילּוּ כֹּל דְּהוּ
human_translation: And Rabbi Shimon? “That they shall declare unto you from that place” even whatsoever.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Shimon, that they will tell you from that place, even all that is.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב הוּנָא בַּר חִינָּנָא לְרָבָא תַּרְגְּמַהּ לִי לְהָא מַתְנִיתָא אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא לְרַב פָּפָּא פּוֹק תַּרְגְּמַהּ לֵיהּ
human_translation: Rav Huna bar Ḥinnana said to Rava: Interpret for me that baraita , in accordance with of Rabbi Meir, Rava said to Rav Pappa Go and interpret for him.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Huna the son of Chinena said to Rava, "Translate for me this Mishnah in the name of Rabbi Meir." Rava said to Rav Papa, "Go, translate it for him."

hebrew_text: כִּי יִפָּלֵא  בְּמוּפְלָא שֶׁבְּבֵית דִּין הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר מִמְּךָ  זֶה יוֹעֵץ שֶׁיּוֹדֵעַ לְעַבֵּר שָׁנִים וְלִקְבּוֹעַ חֳדָשִׁים כְּדִתְנַן הֵן הֵעִידוּ שֶׁמְּעַבְּרִים אֶת הַשָּׁנָה כׇּל אֲדָר שֶׁהָיוּ אוֹמְרִים עַד הַפּוּרִים
human_translation: “If there shall be a matter too hard”; verse is speaking with regard to the most distinguished the court. “For you”; this is an adviser, who knows to intercalate years and establish months. as we learned testified that may intercalate the year entire Adar, as would say until Purim.
llm_translation: When it is wondrous in a wonder in the court, as the Scripture speaks from you, this is a counselor who knows to intercalate years and establish months, as we have learned: "They testified that they would intercalate the year every Adar, until Purim."

hebrew_text: דְּאִי לְהַאי גִּיסָא קָא שָׁרֵי חָמֵץ בְּפֶסַח וְאִי לְהַאי גִּיסָא קָא שָׁרֵי חָמֵץ בְּפֶסַח
human_translation: as, if to this side, permits leavened bread on Passover And if to that side, permits leavened bread on Passover
llm_translation: If for this reason he permits chametz on Passover, and if for that reason he permits chametz on Passover.

hebrew_text: דָּבָר  זֶה הֲלָכָה זוֹ הִלְכַות אַחַד עָשָׂר דְּאִיתְּמַר עֲשִׂירִי רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר עֲשִׂירִי כִּתְשִׁיעִי וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ אָמַר עֲשִׂירִי כְּאַחַד עָשָׂר
human_translation: “A matter”; this is a halakha This the halakhot of eleven As it was stated tenth Rabbi Yoḥanan says: tenth like ninth and Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish says: tenth like eleventh
llm_translation: This matter, this halakha, the laws of the eleventh day, as it was stated: the tenth day, Rabbi Yochanan said the tenth is like the ninth, and Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said the tenth is like the eleventh.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר עֲשִׂירִי כִּתְשִׁיעִי מָה תְּשִׁיעִי בָּעֵי שִׁימּוּר אַף עֲשִׂירִי בָּעֵי שִׁימּוּר
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: tenth like ninth Just as ninth requires observance so too does tenth require observance
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: "The tenth day requires ritual immersion just like the ninth day requires ritual immersion."

hebrew_text: רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר עֲשִׂירִי כְּאַחַד עָשָׂר מָה אַחַד עָשָׂר לֹא בָּעֵי שִׁימּוּר אַף עֲשִׂירִי לָא בָּעֵי שִׁימּוּר
human_translation: Reish Lakish says: tenth like eleventh Just as eleventh does not require observance so too does tenth not require observance
llm_translation: Reish Lakish said: The tenth plague is like the eleventh. What is the eleventh? The eleventh does not require guarding, so too the tenth does not require guarding.

hebrew_text: מִשְׁפָּט  זֶה הַדִּין
human_translation: judgment”; this is a logical inference,
llm_translation: Judgment, this is the law.

hebrew_text: דִּין בִּתּוֹ מֵאֲנוּסָתוֹ
human_translation: halakha one’s daughter from victim of his rape.
llm_translation: The law regarding a man's daughter who refuses.

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר רָבָא אֲמַר לִי רַב יִצְחָק בַּר אֲבוּדִימִי אָתְיָא הֵנָּה הֵנָּה
human_translation: As Rava says: Rav Yitzḥak bar Avudimi said to me: derived henna , henna
llm_translation: Rava said: Rav Yitzchak bar Avudimi said to me, "Come here, come here."

hebrew_text: אָתְיָא זִמָּה זִמָּה
human_translation: derived “lewdness” “lewdness”
llm_translation: It was taught: "Zimah, zimah."

hebrew_text: בֵּין דָּם לְדָם  בֵּין דַּם נִדָּה דַּם לֵידָה דַּם זִיבָה דַּם נִדָּה בִּפְלוּגְתָּא עֲקַבְיָא בֶּן מַהֲלַלְאֵל וְרַבָּנַן דִּתְנַן דָּם הַיָּרוֹק עֲקַבְיָא בֶּן מַהֲלַלְאֵל מְטַמֵּא וַחֲכָמִים מְטַהֲרִין
human_translation: “Between blood and blood”; between blood of menstruation, blood of childbirth, blood of discharge [ ziva ]. blood of menstruation, with regard to the dispute Akavya ben Mahalalel and the Rabbis, as we learned blood that is green Akavya ben Mahalalel deems impure, and the Rabbis deem pure.
llm_translation: Between blood to blood, between the blood of menstruation, the blood of childbirth, the blood of abnormal uterine bleeding, the blood of menstruation in a doubtful case. Akavya ben Mahalalel and the Sages dispute: Akavya ben Mahalalel declares impure, and the Sages declare pure.

hebrew_text: דַּם לֵידָה  בִּפְלוּגְתָּא דְּרַב וְלֵוִי דְּאִתְּמַר רַב אָמַר מֵעֵין אֶחָד הוּא הַתּוֹרָה טִמְּאַתּוּ וְהַתּוֹרָה טִיהֲרַתּוּ
human_translation: blood of childbirth, with regard to the dispute Rav and Levi. as it was stated Rav says: is one source; the Torah deemed ritually impure and the Torah deemed
llm_translation: Blood of childbirth in the dispute of Rav and Levi, as it was said: Rav said, "It is like one kind, the Torah rendered it impure and the Torah rendered it pure."

hebrew_text: וְלֵוִי אָמַר שְׁנֵי מַעֲיָינוֹת הֵן נִסְתָּם הַטָּמֵא נִפְתָּח הַטָּהוֹר נִסְתָּם הַטָּהוֹר נִפְתָּח הַטָּמֵא
human_translation: And Levi says: It is two sources; the impure is sealed the pure is opened, the pure is sealed the impure is opened.
llm_translation: Levi said: "There are two ducts, the impure one is closed, the pure one is open; the pure one is closed, the impure one is open."

hebrew_text: דַּם זִיבָה  בִּפְלוּגְתָּא דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ דִּתְנַן קִישְּׁתָה שְׁלֹשָׁה יָמִים בְּתוֹךְ אַחַד עָשָׂר יוֹם  אִם שָׁפְתָה מֵעֵת לְעֵת וְיָלְדָה  הֲרֵי זוֹ יוֹלֶדֶת בְּזוֹב דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר
human_translation: blood of ziva , with regard to the dispute Rabbi Eliezer and Rabbi Yehoshua. As we learned experienced labor three days within eleven days if she ceased for period, and she gave birth, that gives birth as a zava the statement of Rabbi Eliezer.
llm_translation: Blood of Zivah in the dispute of Rabbi Eliezer and Rabbi Yehoshua as we learned: If she counted three days within one eleven-day period, and she emitted blood intermittently and gave birth, behold, she is considered a birther of Zivah - the words of Rabbi Eliezer.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר לַיְלָה וָיוֹם כְּלֵילֵי שַׁבָּת וְיוֹמוֹ שֶׁשָּׁפְתָה  מִן הַצַּעַר וְלֹא מִן הַדָּם
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehoshua says: a night and day like Shabbat evening and day it. where she ceased from pains and not from the blood.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua says: "Night and day are like the eve of Shabbat, and its day that you spoke of, from sorrow and not from blood."

hebrew_text: בֵּין דִּין לְדִין  בֵּין דִּינֵי מָמוֹנוֹת דִּינֵי נְפָשׁוֹת דִּינֵי מַכּוֹת דִּינֵי מָמוֹנוֹת  בִּפְלוּגְתָּא דִּשְׁמוּאֵל וְרַבִּי אֲבָהוּ דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל שְׁנַיִם שֶׁדָּנוּ דִּינֵיהֶם דִּין אֶלָּא שֶׁנִּקְרָאִין בֵּית דִּין חָצוּף וְרַבִּי אֲבָהוּ אָמַר לְדִבְרֵי הַכֹּל אֵין דִּינֵיהֶן דִּין
human_translation: “Between plea and plea”; between capital law, monetary law, laws lashes. monetary law, with regard to the dispute Shmuel and Rabbi Abbahu, as Shmuel says: two who sat in judgment their ruling is ruling, but they are characterized as an impudent court. And Rabbi Abbahu says: Everyone agrees their ruling is not ruling.
llm_translation: Between judgment and judgment, between monetary judgments, judgments of life, judgments of lashes, monetary judgments, in the dispute of Shmuel and Rabbi Avahu. For Shmuel said: Two who judge, their judgment is a judgment, only that they are called a brazen court. And Rabbi Avahu said: According to everyone's words, their judgments are not a judgment.

hebrew_text: דִּינֵי נְפָשׁוֹת  בִּפְלוּגְתָּא דְּרַבִּי וְרַבָּנַן דְּתַנְיָא רַבִּי אוֹמֵר 'וְנָתַתָּה נֶפֶשׁ תַּחַת נָפֶשׁ' מָמוֹן
human_translation: capital law, with regard to the dispute Rabbi and the Rabbis, as it is taught Rabbi says you shall give a life for a life” a monetary payment
llm_translation: Laws of life in the case of Rabbi and the Rabbis as it was taught: Rabbi says, "And you shall give life for life" - monetary.

hebrew_text: אַתָּה אוֹמֵר מָמוֹן אוֹ אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא נֶפֶשׁ מַמָּשׁ נֶאֱמַר 'נְתִינָה' לְמַעְלָה וְנֶאֱמַר 'נְתִינָה' לְמַטָּה מָה לְהַלָּן מָמוֹן אַף כָּאן מָמוֹן
human_translation: Do you say a monetary payment, or only actual life? giving is stated above: and giving is stated below: Just as there, monetary payment, so too here, monetary payment.
llm_translation: You say, "Money or is it only the actual soul?" It is stated 'a giving' above and it is stated 'a giving' below. Just as there it is money, so too here it is money.

hebrew_text: דִּינֵי מַכּוֹת בִּפְלוּגְתָּא דְּרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל וְרַבָּנַן דִּתְנַן מַכּוֹת בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל אָמְרוּ בְּעֶשְׂרִים וּשְׁלֹשָׁה
human_translation: laws lashes, with regard to the dispute Rabbi Yishmael and the Rabbis, as we learned lashes by three stated in the name of Rabbi Yishmael: by twenty-three
llm_translation: Laws of lashes in the dispute of Rabbi Yishmael and the Rabbis. For we learned: Lashes in three sets in the name of Rabbi Yishmael they said to be given in twenty-three.

hebrew_text: בֵּין נֶגַע לָנֶגַע  בֵּין נִגְעֵי אָדָם נִגְעֵי בָתִּים נִגְעֵי בְגָדִים
human_translation: “Between mark and mark”; between marks of a person, marks on houses, marks on garments.
llm_translation: Between nega to nega, between nega'ei adam nega'ei batim nega'ei begadim.

hebrew_text: נִגְעֵי אָדָם  בִּפְלוּגְתָּא דְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ וְרַבָּנַן דִּתְנַן אִם בַּהֶרֶת קָדַם לַשֵּׂעָר הַלָּבָן  טָמֵא אִם שֵׂעָר לָבָן קָדַם לַבַּהֶרֶת  טָהוֹר סָפֵק  טָמֵא רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר כֵּהָה מַאי כֵּהָה אָמַר רָבָא כֵּהָה טָהוֹר
human_translation: marks of a person, with regard to the dispute Rabbi Yehoshua and the Rabbis, as we learned If the snow-white mark [ baheret ] preceded the white hair, impure if the white hair preceded the baheret , pure. uncertainty impure, Rabbi Yehoshua says: darkened. What darkened? Rava says: darkened, pure.
llm_translation: Afflictions of a person in the dispute of Rabbi Yehoshua and the Rabbis. For we learned: If the white hair preceded the leprosy, it is impure; if the white hair followed the leprosy, it is pure. In a doubtful case, it is impure. Rabbi Yehoshua says: "Light." What is 'light'? Rava said: 'Light' is pure.

hebrew_text: נִגְעֵי בָתִּים בִּפְלוּגְתָּא דְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן וְרַבָּנַן דִּתְנַן רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר לְעוֹלָם אֵין הַבַּיִת טָמֵא עַד שֶׁיֵּרָאֶה כִּשְׁנֵי גְרִיסִין עַל שְׁתֵּי אֲבָנִים (בִּשְׁתֵּי) [בִּשְׁנֵי] כְתָלִים בְּקֶרֶן זָוִית אׇרְכּוֹ כִּשְׁנֵי גְרִיסִין וְרׇחְבּוֹ כִּגְרִיס
human_translation: marks of houses, with regard to the dispute Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, and the Rabbis, as we learned Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, says: A house is never impure unless will be seen two Cilician beans, on two stones, on two walls, in a corner The length of is two Cilician beans and its width is Cilician bean.
llm_translation: The text discusses cases of house impurity according to the opinion of Rabbi Eliezer son of Rabbi Shimon and the sages. For we learned in a Mishnah: Rabbi Eliezer son of Rabbi Shimon says, "A house is never deemed impure until there are seen two beams on two stones in a corner, its length like two beams and its width like a beam."

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן כְּתִיב קִיר וּכְתִיב קִירֹת אֵיזֶהוּ קִיר שֶׁהוּא כְּקִירוֹת הֱוֵי אוֹמֵר זֶה קֶרֶן זָוִית
human_translation: What is the reason of Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon? wall is written and walls is written Which is wall that is like walls? You must say: This is a corner
llm_translation: What is the reason for Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, saying: It is written "wall" and it is written "walls"? Which wall is like its walls? He would say: This is a corner wall.

hebrew_text: נִגְעֵי בְגָדִים  בִּפְלוּגְתָּא דְּרַבִּי יוֹנָתָן בֶּן אַבְטוּלְמוֹס וְרַבָּנַן דְּתַנְיָא רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן בֶּן אַבְטוּלְמוֹס אוֹמֵר מִנַּיִן
human_translation: marks on garments, with regard to the dispute Rabbi Yonatan ben Avtolemos and the Rabbis, as it is taught Rabbi Yonatan ben Avtolemos says: From where
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Neg'ei begadim biflugta d'Rabbi Yonatan ben Avtulmos v'Rabanan d'tanya Rabbi Yonatan ben Avtulmos omer minayin." English translation: "Garment afflictions in the dispute of Rabbi Yonatan ben Avtulmos and the Rabbis as it was taught: Rabbi Yonatan ben Avtulmos says, 'From where?'"

hebrew_text: לִפְרִיחָה בִּבְגָדִים שֶׁהִיא טְהוֹרָה
human_translation: with regard to a spread in garments that is pure,
llm_translation: For blossoming in garments that it is pure.
