hebrew_text: נֶאֶמְרָה קָרַחַת וְגַבַּחַת בָּאָדָם וְנֶאֶמְרָה קָרַחַת וְגַבַּחַת בִּבְגָדִים מָה לְהַלָּן  פָּרַח בְּכוּלּוֹ טָהוֹר אַף כָּאן  פָּרַח בְּכוּלּוֹ טָהוֹר
human_translation: Karaḥat and gabbaḥat are stated with regard to a person and karaḥat and gabbaḥat are stated with regard to garments Just as there, spread to his entire he is pure, so too here, spread to entire it is pure.
llm_translation: It was said: "Karchat and Gabbachat in a person, and it was said: Karchat and Gabbachat in garments. Just as there it blossomed entirely pure, so too here it blossomed entirely pure."

hebrew_text: דִּבְרֵי  אֵלּוּ הָעֲרָכִין וְהַחֲרָמִים וְ[הַ]הֶקְדֵּישׁוֹת הָעֲרָכִין  בִּפְלוּגְתָּא דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר וְרַבָּנַן דִּתְנַן הַמַּעֲרִיךְ פָּחוֹת מִבֶּן חֹדֶשׁ רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר נוֹתֵן דָּמָיו וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים לֹא אָמַר כְּלוּם
human_translation: “Matters of”; these are the valuations, and the dedications, and the consecrations. the valuations, with regard to the dispute Rabbi Meir and the Rabbis, as we learned one who valuates less than one month old, Rabbi Meir says: He gives monetary value of And the Rabbis say: He did not say anything.
llm_translation: Words: These are the valuations and the devoted things and the valuations in the division of Rabbi Meir and the Sages. For we learned: One who values less than a month-old, Rabbi Meir says he gives his value, and the Sages say he does not say anything.

hebrew_text: הַחֲרָמִים  בִּפְלוּגְתָּא דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בְּתִירָה וְרַבָּנַן דִּתְנַן רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בְּתִירָה אוֹמֵר סְתַם חֲרָמִים  לְבֶדֶק הַבַּיִת שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר 'כׇּל חֵרֶם קֹדֶשׁ קֳדָשִׁים הוּא לַה'
human_translation: the dedications, with regard to the dispute Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira and the Rabbis, as we learned Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira says: Dedications without specification for Temple maintenance, as it is stated: “Every dedicated item is most sacred unto the Lord”
llm_translation: The banned items in the dispute of Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira and the Sages, as we learned: Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira says, "Banned items in general are for inspecting the house," as it is stated, "Every ban is most holy to the Lord."

hebrew_text: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים סְתַם חֲרָמִים לַכֹּהֵן שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר 'כִּשְׂדֵה הַחֵרֶם לַכֹּהֵן תִּהְיֶה אֲחֻזָּתוֹ' אִם כֵּן מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר 'קֹדֶשׁ קָדָשִׁים הוּא לַה'  שֶׁחָל עַל קׇדְשֵׁי קָדָשִׁים וְעַל קָדָשִׁים קַלִּים
human_translation: And the Rabbis say: Dedications without specification for the priest, as it is stated “As a field dedicated; to the priest shall be its possession” If so, why the verse state: “Every dedicated item is most sacred unto the Lord”? that takes effect on offerings of the most sacred order and offerings of lesser sanctity.
llm_translation: The sages say: A plain devoted thing is for the priest, as it is stated, "As the devoted field is his possession" (Leviticus 27:21). If so, what is the Talmud to say, "It is most holy to the Lord"? This includes the most holy things and the lighter holy things.

hebrew_text: הֶקְדֵּשׁוֹת  בִּפְלוּגְתָּא דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב וְרַבָּנַן דְּתַנְיָא רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב אוֹמֵר אֲפִילּוּ צִינּוֹרָא שֶׁל הֶקְדֵּשׁ צְרִיכָה עֲשָׂרָה בְּנֵי אָדָם לִפְדּוֹתָהּ
human_translation: consecrations, with regard to the dispute Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov and the Rabbis, as it is taught Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov says: Even a small fork consecrated requires ten people to redeem it.
llm_translation: The sanctified items in the case of Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov and the sages, as it was taught: Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov says, even the smallest tube of the sanctuary requires ten people to redeem it.

hebrew_text: רִיבֹת  זֶה הַשְׁקָאַת סוֹטָה וַעֲרִיפַת הָעֶגְלָה וְטׇהֳרַת מְצוֹרָע הַשְׁקָאַת סוֹטָה  בִּפְלוּגְתָּא דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ דִּתְנַן הַמְקַנֵּא לְאִשְׁתּוֹ רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר מְקַנֵּא עַל פִּי שְׁנַיִם וּמַשְׁקֶה עַל פִּי עֵד אֶחָד אוֹ עַל פִּי עַצְמוֹ
human_translation: “Disputes”; this is the giving waters to a sota to drink, and the heifer whose neck is broken, and the purification of a leper. giving waters to a sota to drink, with regard to the dispute Rabbi Eliezer and Rabbi Yehoshua, as we learned one who issues a warning to his wife Rabbi Eliezer says: He issues a warning based on two And gives waters based on one witness or based on his own
llm_translation: Disputes: This is the watering of the Sotah, and the breaking of the heifer's neck, and the purification of the leper. The watering of the Sotah is in the dispute of Rabbi Eliezer and Rabbi Yehoshua, for we learned: "If a man is jealous of his wife," Rabbi Eliezer says, "he should be jealous based on the testimony of two witnesses, and she should drink based on the testimony of one witness or based on her own admission."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר מְקַנֵּא עַל פִּי שְׁנַיִם וּמַשְׁקֶה עַל פִּי שְׁנַיִם
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua says: issues a warning based on two and gives waters based on two
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua says: "One may acquire through the testimony of two witnesses, and one may administer a drink through the testimony of two witnesses."

hebrew_text: עֲרִיפַת עֶגְלָה  בִּפְלוּגְתָּא דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא דִּתְנַן מֵאַיִן הָיוּ מוֹדְדִין רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר מִטִּיבּוּרוֹ רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר מֵחוֹטְמוֹ רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב אוֹמֵר מִמָּקוֹם שֶׁנַּעֲשֶׂה חָלָל מִצַּוָּארוֹ
human_translation: the heifer whose neck is broken, with regard to the dispute Rabbi Eliezer and Rabbi Akiva, as we learned From where would they measure Rabbi Eliezer says: From his navel. Rabbi Akiva says: From his nose. Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov says: From the place where he became a slain from his neck.
llm_translation: The breaking of the calf in the dispute of Rabbi Eliezer and Rabbi Akiva, as we learned: From where would they measure? Rabbi Eliezer says: from its navel. Rabbi Akiva says: from its nostril. Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov says: from the place where it becomes hollow from its neck.

hebrew_text: טׇהֳרַת מְצוֹרָע  בִּפְלוּגְתָּא דְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן וְרַבָּנַן דִּתְנַן אֵין לוֹ בֹּהֶן יָד בֹּהֶן רֶגֶל אוֹזֶן יְמָנִית  אֵין לוֹ טׇהֳרָה עוֹלָמִית רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר נוֹתֵן לוֹ עַל מְקוֹמוֹ וְיוֹצֵא רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר נוֹתֵן עַל שֶׁל שְׂמֹאל וְיוֹצֵא
human_translation: purification of a leper, with regard to the dispute Rabbi Shimon and the Rabbis, as we learned does not have a thumb, a big toe, a right ear he has no purification forever. Rabbi Eliezer says: places for him on its place, and he fulfills Rabbi Shimon says: places on left and he fulfills
llm_translation: The purification of the leper is in the dispute of Rabbi Shimon and the Rabbis, for we learned: "If he has no thumb, big toe, right ear, he has no eternal purity." Rabbi Eliezer says: "He places it in its place and he is considered pure." Rabbi Shimon says: "He places it on the left side and he is considered pure."

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁעָרֶיךָ  זֶה לֶקֶט שִׁכְחָה פֵּיאָה לֶקֶט  דִּתְנַן שְׁנֵי שִׁבֳּלִין  לֶקֶט שְׁלֹשָׁה  אֵינָן לֶקֶט שִׁכְחָה  שְׁנֵי עוֹמָרִין שִׁכְחָה שְׁלֹשָׁה  אֵינָן שִׁכְחָה
human_translation: “In your gates”; this is gleanings, forgotten produce in the corner of the field [ pe’a ]. gleanings, as we learned Two stalks are gleanings Three are not gleanings forgotten two sheaves, forgotten three are not forgotten
llm_translation: In your gates, this is gleanings, forgotten sheaf, corner of the field. Gleanings of two stalks are not gleanings, forgotten sheaf. Two omers of forgotten sheaf are not forgotten sheaf.

hebrew_text: וְעַל כּוּלָּן בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים שָׁלֹשׁ לְעָנִי וְאַרְבַּע לְבַעַל הַבַּיִת
human_translation: And with regard to all of them, Beit Shammai say: three, to the poor and four, to the owner.
llm_translation: And on all of them Beit Shammai say: three for the poor and four for the homeowner.

hebrew_text: פֵּיאָה  בִּפְלוּגְתָּא דְּרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל וְרַבָּנַן דִּתְנַן מִצְוַת פֵּיאָה לְהַפְרִישׁ מִן הַקָּמָה לֹא הִפְרִישׁ מִן הַקָּמָה  יַפְרִישׁ מִן הָעוֹמָרִין לֹא הִפְרִישׁ מִן הָעוֹמָרִין  יַפְרִישׁ מִן הַכְּרִי עַד שֶׁלֹּא מֵירְחוֹ מֵירְחוֹ  מְעַשֵּׂר וְנוֹתֵן לוֹ
human_translation: pe’a , with regard to the dispute Rabbi Yishmael and the Rabbis, as we learned The mitzva of pe’a to designate from the standing he did not designate from the standing he designates from the sheaves he did not designate it from the sheaves, he designates from the pile before he smooths smoothed he tithes and gives to
llm_translation: Pe'ah in the dispute of Rabbi Yishmael and the Rabbis, as we learned: The obligation of Pe'ah is to separate from the standing crop; if one did not separate from the standing crop, he should separate from the sheaves; if one did not separate from the sheaves, he should separate from the granary until it is no longer needed. He tithes and gives it to him.

hebrew_text: מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל אָמְרוּ אַף מַפְרִישׁ מִן הָעִיסָּה
human_translation: In the name of Rabbi Yishmael they said: One designates even from the dough.
llm_translation: On account of Rabbi Yishmael, they said: Also one separates from the dough.

hebrew_text: שְׁלֹשָׁה בָּתֵּי דִינִין וְכוּ' אָמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא הוּא אוֹמֵר מִפִּי הַשְּׁמוּעָה וְהֵן אוֹמְרִין מִפִּי הַשְּׁמוּעָה  אֵינוֹ נֶהֱרָג
human_translation: three courts Rav Kahana says: says on the basis of the tradition and say on the basis of the tradition is not executed,
llm_translation: Three courts etc. Rav Kahana said he says from the tradition and they say from the tradition he is not killed.

hebrew_text: הוּא אוֹמֵר כָּךְ הוּא בְּעֵינַי וְהֵן אוֹמְרִין כָּךְ הוּא בְּעֵינֵינוּ  אֵינוֹ נֶהֱרָג וְכׇל שֶׁכֵּן הוּא אוֹמֵר מִפִּי הַשְּׁמוּעָה וְהֵן אוֹמְרִין כָּךְ הוּא בְּעֵינֵינוּ  אֵינוֹ נֶהֱרָג עַד שֶׁיֹּאמַר כָּךְ הוּא בְּעֵינַי וְהֵן אוֹמְרִים מִפִּי הַשְּׁמוּעָה תֵּדַע שֶׁהֲרֵי לֹא הָרְגוּ אֶת עֲקַבְיָא בֶּן מַהֲלַלְאֵל
human_translation: says: This is in my eyes, and say: This is in our eyes, he is not executed. And all the more so he says on the basis of the tradition, and say: This is in our eyes, he is not executed. unless he says: This is in my eyes, and say on the basis of the tradition. Know as Akavya ben Mahalalel was not executed
llm_translation: He says, "This is how it appears to me," and they say, "This is how it appears to us." He is not killed, and all the more so, he says based on hearsay, and they say, "This is how it appears to us." He is not killed until he says, "This is how it appears to me," and they say based on hearsay. You should know that they did not kill Akavya ben Mahalalel.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר אֲפִילּוּ הוּא אוֹמֵר מִפִּי הַשְּׁמוּעָה וְהֵן אוֹמְרִין כָּךְ הוּא בְּעֵינֵינוּ  נֶהֱרָג  כְּדֵי שֶׁלֹּא יִרְבּוּ מַחְלוֹקוֹת בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל וְאִם תֹּאמַר מִפְּנֵי מָה לֹא הָרְגוּ אֶת עֲקַבְיָא בֶּן מַהֲלַלְאֵל  מִפְּנֵי שֶׁלֹּא הוֹרָה הֲלָכָה לְמַעֲשֶׂה
human_translation: And Rabbi Elazar says: Even says on the basis of the tradition, and say: This is in our eyes, executed, so that discord will not proliferate among Israel And if you say: For what was Akavya ben Mahalalel not executed? due to that he did not issue practical halakha ;
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar says: Even if he himself says something from what he heard, and they say, "This is how it appears to us," he is to be killed, so that disputes do not increase among the Jewish people. And if you say, "Why were Akavya ben Mahalalel not killed?" It is because he did not teach halacha in practice.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן כָּךְ דָּרַשְׁתִּי וְכָךְ דָּרְשׁוּ חֲבֵירַי כָּךְ לִמַּדְתִּי וְכָךְ לִמְּדוּ חֲבֵירַי מַאי לָאו דְּהוּא אָמַר מִפִּי הַשְּׁמוּעָה וְהֵם אוֹמְרִין כָּךְ הוּא בְּעֵינֵינוּ לָא הוּא אוֹמֵר כָּךְ הוּא בְּעֵינַי וְהֵם אוֹמְרִים מִפִּי הַשְּׁמוּעָה
human_translation: We learned This I interpreted and that my colleagues interpreted; this I taught and that my colleagues taught. What, is it not where he says on the basis of the tradition, and say: This is in our eyes? No, he says: This is in my eyes, and say on the basis of the tradition.
llm_translation: We learned: Thus I expounded, and thus my colleagues expounded. Thus I taught, and thus my colleagues taught. What is the difference? It is not that he said from hearsay, and they say, "It is so in our eyes." He does not say, "It is so in my eyes," and they say from hearsay.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יֹאשִׁיָּה שְׁלֹשָׁה דְּבָרִים סָח לִי זְעֵירָא מֵאַנְשֵׁי יְרוּשָׁלַיִם בַּעַל שֶׁמָּחַל עַל קִינּוּיוֹ  קִינּוּיוֹ מָחוּל
human_translation: Come hear which Rabbi Yoshiya says: three matters Zeira, of the residents of Jerusalem, said to me: a husband who, retracted his warning, his warning is retracted,
llm_translation: Come and hear, for Rabbi Yoshiyah said: Three things I have learned from the people of Jerusalem - a husband who forgives his wife's reproach, his reproach is forgiven.

hebrew_text: בֵּן סוֹרֵר וּמוֹרֶה שֶׁרָצוּ אָבִיו וְאִמּוֹ לִמְחוֹל לוֹ  מוֹחֲלִין לוֹ
human_translation: a stubborn and rebellious son whose father and mother sought to forgive him they forgive him.
llm_translation: Son of a rebellious and defiant son, whose father and mother have admonished him, yet he does not heed them, they forgive him.

hebrew_text: זָקֵן מַמְרֵא שֶׁרָצוּ בֵּית דִּינוֹ לִמְחוֹל לוֹ  מוֹחֲלִין לוֹ וּכְשֶׁבָּאתִי אֵצֶל חֲבֵירַי שֶׁבַּדָּרוֹם עַל שְׁנַיִם הוֹדוּ לִי עַל זָקֵן מַמְרֵא לֹא הוֹדוּ לִי כְּדֵי שֶׁלֹּא יִרְבּוּ מַחְלוֹקוֹת בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל תְּיוּבְתָּא
human_translation: a rebellious elder whom his court sought to forgive they forgive him. And when I came to my colleagues in the South, with regard to two they agreed with me, with regard to a rebellious elder they did not agree with me, so that discord not proliferate in Israel. a conclusive refutation
llm_translation: Elder Mamre, when the court wanted to annul his vow, they annul it for him. And when I came to my colleagues in the South, concerning two matters they acknowledged to me, regarding Elder Mamre they did not acknowledge to me, so that disputes may not increase among the people of Israel. This is the conclusion.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי מִתְּחִילָּה לֹא הָיוּ (מַרְבִּין) מַחְלוֹקוֹת בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל אֶלָּא בֵּית דִּין שֶׁל שִׁבְעִים וְאֶחָד יוֹשְׁבִין בְּלִשְׁכַּת הַגָּזִית וּשְׁנֵי בָּתֵּי דִינִין שֶׁל עֶשְׂרִים וּשְׁלֹשָׁה אֶחָד יוֹשֵׁב עַל פֶּתַח הַר הַבַּיִת וְאֶחָד יוֹשֵׁב עַל פֶּתַח הָעֲזָרָה וּשְׁאָר בָּתֵּי דִינִין שֶׁל עֶשְׂרִים וּשְׁלֹשָׁה יוֹשְׁבִין בְּכׇל עַיְירוֹת יִשְׂרָאֵל
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Yosei said: Initially, discord would not proliferate among Israel. Rather, the court of seventy-one would sit in the Chamber of Hewn Stone. And two courts of twenty-three one convene at the entrance to the Temple Mount, and one convene at the entrance to the courtyard. And all the other courts of twenty-three convene in all cities Jewish people.
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Yosei said, "Initially, disputes were not common among the Jewish people except for the Sanhedrin of seventy-one who sat in the Chamber of Hewn Stone, and the two courts of twenty-three. One sat at the entrance of the Temple Mount, and one sat at the entrance of the Azarah. And the rest of the courts of twenty-three sat in all the cities of Israel."

hebrew_text: הוּצְרַךְ הַדָּבָר לִשְׁאוֹל  שׁוֹאֲלִין מִבֵּית דִּין שֶׁבְּעִירָן אִם שָׁמְעוּ  אָמְרוּ לָהֶן וְאִם לָאו  בָּאִין לָזֶה שֶׁסָּמוּךְ לְעִירָן אִם שָׁמְעוּ  אָמְרוּ לָהֶם וְאִם לָאו  בָּאִין לָזֶה שֶׁעַל פֶּתַח הַר הַבַּיִת אִם שָׁמְעוּ  אָמְרוּ לָהֶם וְאִם לָאו בָּאִין לָזֶה שֶׁעַל פֶּתַח הָעֲזָרָה
human_translation: the matter was necessary to ask ask the court that is in their city. If heard they said to them, and if not, they come to that is adjacent to their city. If heard they said to them, and if not, they come to the court at the entrance to the Temple Mount. If heard they said to them, and if not, they come to the court at the entrance to the courtyard.
llm_translation: The matter requires inquiring: they ask from the court of their city if they heard, they said to them, "And if not," they come to this one adjacent to their city if they heard, they said to them, "And if not," they come to this one at the entrance of the Temple Mount if they heard, they said to them, "And if not," they come to this one at the entrance of the Azarah.

hebrew_text: וְאוֹמֵר 'כָּךְ דָּרַשְׁתִּי וְכָךְ דָּרְשׁוּ חֲבֵירַי כָּךְ לִמַּדְתִּי וְכָךְ לִמְּדוּ חֲבֵירַי' אִם שָׁמְעוּ  אָמְרוּ לָהֶם וְאִם לָאו  אֵלּוּ וָאֵלּוּ בָּאִין לְלִשְׁכַּת הַגָּזִית שֶׁשָּׁם יוֹשְׁבִין מִתָּמִיד שֶׁל שַׁחַר עַד תָּמִיד שֶׁל בֵּין הָעַרְבַּיִם
human_translation: And says: This I interpreted and that my colleagues interpreted; this I taught and that my colleagues taught. If heard they said to them, and if not, these and those come to the Chamber of Hewn Stone, where convened from the daily morning offering until the daily afternoon offering
llm_translation: And he says, "Thus I have expounded, and thus my colleagues have expounded. Thus I have learned, and thus my colleagues have learned." If they heard, they said to them, and if not, these and these enter the Chamber of Hewn Stone, where they sit constantly from the morning offering until the evening offering.

hebrew_text: וּבְשַׁבָּתוֹת וּבְיָמִים טוֹבִים יוֹשְׁבִין בַּחֵיל נִשְׁאֲלָה שְׁאֵלָה בִּפְנֵיהֶם אִם שָׁמְעוּ  אָמְרוּ לָהֶם וְאִם לָאו  עוֹמְדִין לַמִּנְיָן רַבּוּ הַמְטַמְּאִים  טִמְּאוּ רַבּוּ הַמְּטַהֲרִין  טִהֲרוּ
human_translation: And on Shabbatot and Festivals, would sit at the rampart. a question was asked before them, if heard they would say to them, and if not they would stand for a vote who deemed ritually impure outnumbered would deem impure. who deemed ritually pure outnumbered would deem pure.
llm_translation: On Shabbat and festivals, they sit in the courtyard. A question was asked before them: "Did you hear?" They said to them, "Yes." And if not, they stand for the count. The majority who render impure, they render impure. The majority who render pure, they render pure.

hebrew_text: מִשֶּׁרַבּוּ תַּלְמִידֵי שַׁמַּאי וְהִלֵּל שֶׁלֹּא שִׁמְּשׁוּ כׇּל צָרְכָּן  רַבּוּ מַחְלוֹקוֹת בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל וְנַעֲשֵׂית תּוֹרָה כִּשְׁתֵּי תוֹרוֹת
human_translation: From that the disciples of Shammai and Hillel grew in number, who did not attend to the requisite dispute proliferated among the Jewish people and the Torah became like two Torahs.
llm_translation: From when multiplied disciples of Shamai and Hillel that not they served all their needs, increased disputes in Israel and Torah became like two Torahs.

hebrew_text: מִשָּׁם כּוֹתְבִין וְשׁוֹלְחִין בְּכׇל מְקוֹמוֹת כׇּל מִי שֶׁהוּא חָכָם וּשְׁפַל בֶּרֶךְ וְדַעַת הַבְּרִיּוֹת נוֹחָה הֵימֶנּוּ  יְהֵא דַּיָּין בְּעִירוֹ מִשָּׁם מַעֲלִין אוֹתוֹ לְהַר הַבַּיִת מִשָּׁם לָעֲזָרָה מִשָּׁם לְלִשְׁכַּת הַגָּזִית
human_translation: From there, writes and dispatches to all places: Anyone who is wise and humble and the minds of people are at ease with him shall be a judge in his city. from there, they promote him to the the Temple Mount from there to the courtyard, from there to the Chamber of Hewn Stone.
llm_translation: From there they write and send in all places, anyone who is wise, humble in spirit, and has knowledge of the creatures, his judgment should be in his city. From there they elevate him to the Temple Mount, from there to the Azarah, from there to the Chamber of Hewn Stone.

hebrew_text: שְׁלַחוּ מִתָּם אֵיזֶהוּ בֶּן הָעוֹלָם הַבָּא  עַנְוְותָן וּשְׁפַל בֶּרֶךְ שָׁיֵיף עָיֵיל שָׁיֵיף וְנָפֵיק וְגָרֵיס בְּאוֹרָיְיתָא תְּדִירָא וְלָא מַחְזֵיק טֵיבוּתָא לְנַפְשֵׁיהּ יְהַבוּ בֵּיהּ רַבָּנַן עֵינַיְיהוּ בְּרַב עוּלָּא בַּר אַבָּא
human_translation: they sent from there, Who is destined the World-to-Come? modest and humble, bows enters bows exits, and studies Torah regularly, and does not take credit for himself. The Sages cast their eyes on Rav Ulla bar Abba,
llm_translation: Send from there who is the son of the world who comes humble and lowly in spirit, sharp in intellect, sharp in understanding, and goes out and delves deeply into the Torah, constantly learning and not holding onto his own goodness. The Rabbis placed their eyes on Rav Ula the son of Abba.

hebrew_text: חָזַר לְעִירוֹ וְשָׁנָה  תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב עַד שֶׁיַּעֲשֶׂה כְּהוֹרָאָתוֹ אוֹ שֶׁיּוֹרֶה לַאֲחֵרִים וְיַעֲשׂוּ כְּהוֹרָאָתוֹ
human_translation: returned to his city and he taught The Sages taught: He is not liable unless he acts in accordance with his ruling, or he instructs others and they act in accordance with his ruling.
llm_translation: He returned to his city and repeated. The sages taught: One is not liable until he acts according to his ruling or instructs others to act according to his ruling.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא יוֹרֶה לַאֲחֵרִים וְיַעֲשׂוּ כְּהוֹרָאָתוֹ מֵעִיקָּרָא לָאו בַּר קְטָלָא הוּא וְהַשְׁתָּא בַּר קְטָלָא הוּא אֶלָּא שֶׁיַּעֲשֶׂה כְּהוֹרָאָתוֹ מֵעִיקָּרָא נָמֵי בַּר קְטָלָא הוּא הָתִינַח הֵיכָא דְּאוֹרִי בְּחֵלֶב וָדָם דְּמֵעִיקָּרָא לָאו בַּר קְטָלָא הוּא וְהַשְׁתָּא בַּר קְטָלָא הוּא אֶלָּא הֵיכָא דְּאוֹרִי בְּחַיָּיבֵי מִיתוֹת בֵּית דִּין מֵעִיקָּרָא נָמֵי בַּר קְטָלָא הוּא
human_translation: Granted, he instructs others and they act in accordance with his ruling initially, not liable to death and now, to death But he acts in accordance with his ruling, initially, also liable to death This works out well where he ruled with regard to fat and blood, as initially he not liable to death and now he is liable to death But where he ruled with regard to liable a court death initially, is also liable to death
llm_translation: In peace, he instructs others, and they should act according to his instruction. Initially, he is not a son of death, and now he is not a son of death either, but rather he should act according to his instruction from the beginning. Also, he is a son of death where he speaks of forbidden fat and blood. Initially, he is not a son of death, and now he is not a son of death either, but rather where he speaks of those liable to capital punishment by the court, he is a son of death from the beginning.

hebrew_text: מֵעִיקָּרָא בָּעֵי הַתְרָאָה הַשְׁתָּא לָא בָּעֵי הַתְרָאָה
human_translation: initially, he requires forewarning now, he does not require forewarning
llm_translation: From the outset, he requires warning; now he does not require warning.

hebrew_text: מֵסִית דְּלָא בָּעֵי הַתְרָאָה מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר מֵעִיקָּרָא אִי אָמַר טַעְמָא מְקַבְּלִינַן מִינֵּיהּ הַשְׁתָּא אִי אָמַר טַעְמָא לָא מְקַבְּלִינַן מִינֵּיהּ
human_translation: instigates who does not require forewarning, what is there to say? Initially, if stated a reason we accept from him Now, if he stated a reason, we do not accept from him,
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "If a seducer who does not require warning, what is there to say? Initially, if he said a reason, we accept it from him now. If he did not say a reason, we do not accept it from him."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי' חוֹמֶר בְּדִבְרֵי סוֹפְרִים מִבְּדִבְרֵי  תוֹרָה הָאוֹמֵר אֵין תְּפִילִּין כְּדֵי לַעֲבוֹר עַל דִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה  פָּטוּר חָמֵשׁ טוֹטָפוֹת לְהוֹסִיף עַל דִּבְרֵי סוֹפְרִים  חַיָּיב
human_translation: stringency with regard to rabbinic interpretations than with regard to matters of Torah. one states: no phylacteries, in order to violate matters of Torah, exempt five compartments to add to rabbinic interpretations liable.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: More stringent in matters of the scribes than in matters of the Torah. One who says, "There are no phylacteries for the purpose of transgressing the words of the Torah," is exempt. If he adds five compartments to them beyond the words of the scribes, he is liable.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ' אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אָמַר רַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב אֶלָּא עַל דָּבָר שֶׁעִיקָּרוֹ מִדִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה וּפֵירוּשׁוֹ מִדִּבְרֵי סוֹפְרִים וְיֵשׁ בּוֹ לְהוֹסִיף וְאִם הוֹסִיף גּוֹרֵעַ וְאֵין לָנוּ אֶלָּא תְּפִילִּין אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar says Rabbi Oshaya says: One is liable only for a matter whose essence, is from matters of Torah and whose explanation is from rabbinic interpretations and which includes to add and if one added one compromises And we have only phylacteries And in accordance with of Rabbi Yehuda,
llm_translation: Gemara: Rabbi Elazar said, Rabbi Oshaya said: One is only liable for something whose essence is from the words of the Torah, and its explanation is from the words of the Scribes. And there is room to add to it, but if one adds, it subtracts. And we only have tefillin according to the opinion of Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: וְהָאִיכָּא לוּלָב דְּעִיקָּרוֹ מִדִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה וּפֵירוּשׁוֹ מִדִּבְרֵי סוֹפְרִים וְיֵשׁ בּוֹ לְהוֹסִיף וְאִם הוֹסִיף גּוֹרֵעַ
human_translation: But isn’t there lulav whose essence is from matters of Torah, and whose explanation is from rabbinic interpretations and which includes to add and if one added one compromises
llm_translation: And there is a lulav whose essence is from the words of the Torah and its explanation from the words of the Sages, and there is room to add to it, and if one adds, it detracts.

hebrew_text: בְּלוּלָב מַאי סְבִירָא לַן אִי סְבִירָא לַן דְּלוּלָב אֵין צָרִיךְ אֶגֶד הַאי לְחוֹדֵיהּ קָאֵי וְהַאי לְחוֹדֵיהּ קָאֵי וְאִי סְבִירָא לַן דְּצָרִיךְ אֶגֶד גָּרוּעַ וְעוֹמֵד הוּא
human_translation: with regard to lulav , what do we hold? If we hold that a lulav does not require binding these stand alone and that stands alone. And if we hold a lulav requires binding is already compromised
llm_translation: Lulav, what does it hold for us? If it holds for us that a lulav is not needed, this one stands for itself, and this one stands for itself. And if it holds for us that a bundle is needed, it is a diminished bundle and it stands.

hebrew_text: וְהָאִיכָּא צִיצִית דְּעִיקָּרוֹ מִדִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה וּפֵירוּשׁוֹ מִדִּבְרֵי סוֹפְרִים וְיֵשׁ בּוֹ לְהוֹסִיף וְאִם הוֹסִיף גּוֹרֵעַ
human_translation: But isn’t there ritual fringes, whose essence is from matters of Torah, and whose explanation is from rabbinic interpretations and which includes to add and if one added one compromises
llm_translation: And there is a case of tzitzit whose primary law is from the words of the Torah, and its explanation is from the words of the Sages, and there is room to add to it, and if one adds, he subtracts.

hebrew_text: בְּצִיצִית מַאי סְבִירָא לַן אִי סְבִירָא לַן דְּקֶשֶׁר הָעֶלְיוֹן לָאו דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא הַאי לְחוֹדֵיהּ קָאֵי וְהַאי לְחוֹדֵיהּ קָאֵי וְאִי סְבִירָא לַן
human_translation: with regard to ritual fringes, what do we hold? If we hold that the upper knot is not by Torah law, these are independent and that is independent And if we hold
llm_translation: In the tzitzit, what do we hold? If we hold that the upper knot is not of biblical origin, this one stands for itself, and this one stands for itself. And if we hold...

hebrew_text: דְּקֶשֶׁר הָעֶלְיוֹן דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא גָּרוּעַ וְעוֹמֵד
human_translation: that the upper knot by Torah law, is already compromised
llm_translation: The knot of the upper world is greater and stands.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי תְּפִילִּין נָמֵי  אִי עֲבַיד אַרְבְּעָה בָּתֵּי וְאַיְיתִי אַחֲרִינָא וְאַנַּח גַּבַּיְיהוּ הַאי לְחוֹדֵיהּ קָאֵי וְהַאי לְחוֹדֵיהּ קָאֵי וְאִי עֲבַיד חַמְשָׁה בָּתֵּי גָּרוּעַ וְעוֹמֵד הוּא הָאָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא בַּיִת חִיצוֹן שֶׁאֵינוֹ רוֹאֶה אֶת הָאֲוִיר  פָּסוּל
human_translation: If so, phylacteries also If one crafts four compartments, and brings another and places alongside them, these stand alone and that stands alone And if one crafts five compartments, is already compromised But doesn’t Rabbi Zeira say: an outer compartment that is not exposed to the air, unfit
llm_translation: So, if one makes four compartments in the tefillin and then brings another one, and we are in doubt about which one is standing for itself and which one is standing for itself, and if one makes five compartments and removes one, and it stands, this is what Rabbi Zeira said: an outer house that does not see the air is invalid.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי' אֵין מְמִיתִין אוֹתוֹ לֹא בְּבֵית דִּין שֶׁבְּעִירוֹ וְלֹא בְּבֵית דִּין שֶׁבְּיַבְנֶה אֶלָּא מַעֲלִין אוֹתוֹ לְבֵית דִּין הַגָּדוֹל שֶׁבִּירוּשָׁלַיִם וּמְשַׁמְּרִין אוֹתוֹ עַד הָרֶגֶל וּמְמִיתִין אוֹתוֹ בָּרֶגֶל שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וְכׇל הָעָם יִשְׁמְעוּ וְיִרָאוּ וְלֹא יְזִידוּן עוֹד דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר אֵין מְעַנִּין אֶת דִּינוֹ שֶׁל זֶה אֶלָּא מְמִיתִין אוֹתוֹ מִיָּד וְכוֹתְבִין וְשׁוֹלְחִין שְׁלוּחִין בְּכׇל הַמְּקוֹמוֹת אִישׁ פְּלוֹנִי מִתְחַיֵּיב מִיתָה בְּבֵית דִּין
human_translation: One does not execute neither in the court that is in his city, nor in the court that is in Yavne, Rather, one takes him up to the High Court in Jerusalem. And they guard him until the pilgrimage Festival, and executes him during the pilgrimage Festival, as it is stated: “And all the nation shall hear, and fear, and no longer sin intentionally” the statement of Rabbi Akiva. Rabbi Yehuda says: One does not delay justice this Rather, executes him immediately, and write and dispatch agents to all the places, So-and-so is liable court death
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: They do not execute him neither by the court of his city nor by the court of Yavneh, but they bring him up to the Great Court in Jerusalem, and they guard him until the Festival. And they execute him on the Festival, as it is stated: "And all the people shall hear and fear, and do no more presumptuously." These are the words of Rabbi Akiva. Rabbi Yehuda says: They do not delay his judgment, but they execute him immediately, and they write and send messengers to all places: So-and-so is liable to the death penalty by the court.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ' תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן אֵין מְמִיתִין אוֹתוֹ לֹא בְּבֵית דִּין שֶׁבְּעִירוֹ וְלֹא בְּבֵית דִּין שֶׁבְּיַבְנֶה אֶלָּא מַעֲלִין אוֹתוֹ לְבֵית דִּין הַגָּדוֹל שֶׁבִּירוּשָׁלַיִם וּמְשַׁמְּרִין אוֹתוֹ עַד הָרֶגֶל וּמְמִיתִין אוֹתוֹ בָּרֶגֶל שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר 'וְכׇל הָעָם יִשְׁמְעוּ וְיִרָאוּ' דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא
human_translation: The Sages taught One does not execute neither in the court that is in his city, nor in the court that is in Yavne. Rather, one takes him up to the High Court that is in Jerusalem. And they guard him until the pilgrimage Festival, and executes him during the pilgrimage Festival, as it is stated: “And all the nation shall hear, and fear” the statement of Rabbi Akiva.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: They do not execute him neither in the court of his city nor in the court of Yavneh, rather they bring him up to the Great Court in Jerusalem and keep him until the Festival pilgrimage. They then execute him at the Festival pilgrimage, as it is stated: "And let all the people hear and fear" - the words of Rabbi Akiva.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי יְהוּדָה וְכִי נֶאֱמַר 'יִרְאוּ וְיִירָאוּ' וַהֲלֹא לֹא נֶאֱמַר אֶלָּא 'יִשְׁמְעוּ וְיִירָאוּ' לָמָּה מְעַנִּין דִּינוֹ שֶׁל זֶה אֶלָּא מְמִיתִין אוֹתוֹ מִיָּד וְכוֹתְבִין וְשׁוֹלְחִין בְּכׇל מָקוֹם אִישׁ פְּלוֹנִי נִתְחַיֵּיב מִיתָה בְּבֵית דִּין
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda said to Is it stated: shall see and fear, But isn’t it stated only: shall hear and fear,” Why delay justice this Rather, executes him immediately, and write and dispatch agents to all the places So-and-so was liable execution in court.
llm_translation: He said to him Rabbi Yehuda, is it stated 'they shall see and fear' and wasn't it only stated 'they shall hear and fear'? Why does the judgment of this one concern us except that we immediately put him to death, write and send in every place, "So-and-so is liable to the death penalty by the court."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן אַרְבָּעָה צְרִיכִין הַכְרָזָה הַמֵּסִית וּבֵן סוֹרֵר וּמוֹרֶה וְזָקֵן מַמְרֵא וְעֵדִים זוֹמְמִין בְּכוּלְּהוּ כְּתִיב בְּהוּ וְכׇל הָעָם וְכׇל יִשְׂרָאֵל בְּעֵדִים זוֹמְמִין כְּתִיב וְהַנִּשְׁאָרִים דְּלָא כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא חֲזוּ לְסָהֲדוּתָא
human_translation: The Sages taught: four require a proclamation One who instigates and the stubborn and rebellious son, and the rebellious elder, and conspiring witnesses. In all of these it is written concerning them: “And all the nation” “And all Israel” with regard to conspiring witnesses, it is written: “And those who remain as not everyone is fit for testimony.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: Four require public proclamation - the seducer, the rebellious son, the teacher of false doctrines, and the stubborn elder. And witnesses who conspire are invalid in all cases. It is written regarding them, "And all the people" and "all Israel." It is written regarding witnesses who conspire, "And the rest shall hear and fear."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי' נְבִיא הַשֶּׁקֶר הַמִּתְנַבֵּא מַה שֶּׁלֹּא שָׁמַע וּמַה שֶּׁלֹּא נֶאֱמַר לוֹ  מִיתָתוֹ בִּידֵי אָדָם
human_translation: The false prophet one who prophesies that which he did not hear and that which was not said to him, his execution is at the hand of man,
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: A false prophet, who prophesies that which he did not hear and that which was not said to him, his death is at the hands of man.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל הַכּוֹבֵשׁ אֶת נְבוּאָתוֹ וְהַמְוַותֵּר עַל דִּבְרֵי נָבִיא וְנָבִיא שֶׁעָבַר עַל דִּבְרֵי עַצְמוֹ  מִיתָתוֹ בִּידֵי שָׁמַיִם שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר אָנֹכִי אֶדְרֹשׁ מֵעִמּוֹ
human_translation: But one who suppresses his prophecy and one who forgoes the statement of a prophet and a prophet who violated his own statement his death is at the hand of Heaven, as it is stated: I will exact it of him”
llm_translation: But one who suppresses his prophecy and the one who contradicts the words of a prophet, and a prophet who contradicts his own words, his death is by the hands of Heaven, as it is said, "I will require it of him."

hebrew_text: הַמִּתְנַבֵּא בְּשֵׁם עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה וְאוֹמֵר כָּךְ אָמְרָה עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה אֲפִילּוּ כִּוֵּון אֶת הַהֲלָכָה לְטַמֵּא אֶת הַטָּמֵא וּלְטַהֵר אֶת הַטָּהוֹר
human_translation: One who prophesies in the name of idol worship and says: This idol said, even he approximated the halakha to deem ritually impure that which is ritually impure and to deem ritually pure that which is ritually pure,
llm_translation: One who prophesies in the name of idolatry and says, "Thus said idolatry," even if he intended to render the halakha to render the impure one impure and the pure one pure.

hebrew_text: הַבָּא עַל אֵשֶׁת אִישׁ  כֵּיוָן שֶׁנִּכְנְסָה לִרְשׁוּת הַבַּעַל לְנִשּׂוּאִין אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁלֹּא נִבְעֲלָה  הַבָּא עָלֶיהָ הֲרֵי זֶה בְּחֶנֶק
human_translation: one who engages in intercourse with a married woman once she entered her husband’s domain for marriage, even if she did not engage in intercourse one who engages in intercourse with her is by strangulation.
llm_translation: One who comes upon a married woman, once she has entered the domain of her husband for the purpose of marriage, even though she has not yet been betrothed, if one engages with her, this is considered as if he engaged in strangulation.

hebrew_text: וְזוֹמְמֵי בַּת כֹּהֵן וּבוֹעֲלָהּ שֶׁכׇּל הַמּוּזַמִּין מַקְדִּימִין לְאוֹתָהּ מִיתָה חוּץ מִזּוֹמְמֵי בַּת כֹּהֵן וּבוֹעֲלָהּ
human_translation: And conspiring the daughter of a priest And her paramour As all who are rendered conspiring witnesses are led to the same execution except for conspiring the daughter of a priest and her paramour
llm_translation: Accusers of daughter of priest and her husband that all the plotters precede her death except accusers of daughter of priest and her husband.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ' תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן שְׁלֹשָׁה מִיתָתָן בִּידֵי אָדָם וּשְׁלֹשָׁה מִיתָתָן בִּידֵי שָׁמַיִם הַמִּתְנַבֵּא מַה שֶּׁלֹּא שָׁמַע וּמַה שֶּׁלֹּא נֶאֱמַר לוֹ וְהַמִּתְנַבֵּא בְּשֵׁם עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה  מִיתָתָן בִּידֵי אָדָם הַכּוֹבֵשׁ אֶת נְבוּאָתוֹ וְהַמְוַותֵּר עַל דִּבְרֵי נָבִיא וְנָבִיא שֶׁעָבַר עַל דִּבְרֵי עַצְמוֹ  מִיתָתָן בִּידֵי שָׁמַיִם
human_translation: The Sages taught three their execution is at the hand of man, and three their execution is at the hand of Heaven. one who prophesies that which he did not hear and that which was not stated to him, and one who prophesies in the name of idol worship, their execution is at the hand of man. one who suppresses his prophecy, and one who forgoes the statement of a prophet, and a prophet who violated his own statement, their execution is at the hand of Heaven.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: Three types of death are in the hands of man, and three types of death are in the hands of Heaven. Death by the sword, death by stoning, and death by burning are in the hands of man. One who prophesies that which he did not hear, or that which was not said to him, and one who prophesies in the name of idolatry - his death is in the hands of man. One who suppresses his prophecy, and one who is lenient regarding the words of a prophet, and a prophet who transgresses his own words - their death is in the hands of Heaven.

hebrew_text: מְנָהָנֵי מִילֵּי אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב דְּאָמַר קְרָא אַךְ הַנָּבִיא אֲשֶׁר יָזִיד לְדַבֵּר דָּבָר בִּשְׁמִי  זֶה הַמִּתְנַבֵּא מַה שֶּׁלֹּא שָׁמַע וַאֲשֶׁר לֹא צִוִּיתִיו  הָא לַחֲבֵירוֹ צִוִּיתִיו זֶה הַמִּתְנַבֵּא מַה שֶּׁלֹּא נֶאֱמַר לוֹ וַאֲשֶׁר יְדַבֵּר בְּשֵׁם אֱלֹהִים אֲחֵרִים  זֶה הַמִּתְנַבֵּא בְּשֵׁם עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה וּכְתִיב וּמֵת הַנָּבִיא הַהוּא וְכׇל מִיתָה הָאֲמוּרָה בְּתוֹרָה סְתָם אֵינָהּ אֶלָּא חֶנֶק
human_translation: From where are these matters Rav Yehuda says Rav says as the verse states: “But the prophet who shall sin intentionally to speak a word in My name”; this one who prophesies that which he did not hear. “That I have not commanded him,” But I did command another. This one who prophesies that which was not stated to him. “Or who shall speak in the name of other gods”; this one who prophesies in the name of idol worship. And it is written “That prophet shall die.” And every death stated in the Torah without specification nothing other than strangulation.
llm_translation: Beneficial words, said Rav Yehudah said Rav, as the verse states, "But the prophet who presumes to speak a word in My name, that which I did not command him to speak, or who speaks in the name of other gods, that prophet shall die." And any death mentioned in the Torah without specification is only by strangulation.

hebrew_text: הַכּוֹבֵשׁ אֶת נְבוּאָתוֹ וְהַמְוַותֵּר עַל דִּבְרֵי נָבִיא וְנָבִיא שֶׁעָבַר עַל דִּבְרֵי עַצְמוֹ  מִיתָתָן בִּידֵי שָׁמַיִם דִּכְתִיב וְהָאִישׁ אֲשֶׁר לֹא יִשְׁמַע קְרִי בֵּיהּ לֹא יַשְׁמִיעַ  וּקְרִי בֵּיהּ לֹא יִשְׁמַע אֶל דְּבָרַי וּכְתִיב אָנֹכִי אֶדְרֹשׁ מֵעִמּוֹ  בִּידֵי שָׁמַיִם
human_translation: One who suppresses his prophecy, and one who forgoes the statement of a prophet, and a prophet who violated his own statement, their execution is at the hand of Heaven, as it is written: whosoever shall not hearken [ yishma ] unto My words Read into shall not voice [ yashmia ]; And read into Shall not heed [ yishama ]; And it is written “I will exact from him,” at the hand of Heaven.
llm_translation: The one who suppresses his prophecy and the one who contradicts the words of a prophet, and a prophet who contradicts his own words - their death is in the hands of Heaven, as it is written, "But the man who will act presumptuously and will not listen to the priest who stands to serve there before the Lord your God, or to the judge, that man shall die" (Deuteronomy 17:12). And it is written, "I will require it of him" (Ezekiel 3:20) - in the hands of Heaven.

hebrew_text: הַמִּתְנַבֵּא מַה שֶּׁלֹּא שָׁמַע  כְּגוֹן צִדְקִיָּה בֶן כְּנַעֲנָה דִּכְתִיב וַיַּעַשׂ לוֹ צִדְקִיָּהוּ בֶן כְּנַעֲנָה קַרְנֵי בַרְזֶל מַאי הֲוָה לֵיהּ לְמֶעְבַּד רוּחַ נָבוֹת אַטְעִיתֵיהּ דִּכְתִיב וַיֹּאמֶר ה' מִי יְפַתֶּה אֶת אַחְאָב וְיַעַל וְיִפֹּל בְּרָמֹת גִּלְעָד וַיֵּצֵא הָרוּחַ וַיַּעֲמֹד לִפְנֵי ה' וַיֹּאמֶר אֲנִי אֲפַתֶּנּוּ וַיֹּאמֶר תְּפַתֶּה וְגַם תּוּכָל צֵא וַעֲשֵׂה כֵן
human_translation: one who prophesies that which did not hear. For example, Zedekiah, son of Chenaanah, as it is written: “And Zedekiah, son of Chenaanah, made for him horns of iron, What was to do? the spirit of Naboth misled him, as it is written: “And the Lord said: Who shall entice Ahab, that he may go up and fall at Ramoth Gilead…and there came forth the spirit, and stood before the Lord, and said: I will entice him. And He said…You shall entice him, and shall prevail also; go forth, and do so”
llm_translation: The one who prophesies what he has not heard, such as Zedekiah son of Canaana, as it is written: "And Zedekiah son of Canaana made horns of iron for himself." What was it for him to do with the spirit of prophets? As it is written: "And the Lord said, 'Who will entice Ahab, so that he will go up and fall at Ramoth-gilead?' And one said one thing, and another said another. Then a spirit came forward and stood before the Lord and said, 'I will entice him.' And the Lord said to him, 'How?' He replied, 'I will go out and be a lying spirit in the mouth of all his prophets.' And He said, 'You will entice him and also prevail. Go out and do so.'"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה מַאי צֵא  צֵא מִמְּחִיצָתִי מַאי רוּחַ אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן רוּחוֹ שֶׁל נָבוֹת הַיִּזְרְעֵאלִי
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says: What “Go forth”? Go forth from My proximity. What spirit Rabbi Yoḥanan says: the spirit of Naboth the Jezreelite,
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said: What is "Tzei"? Tzei from my partition. What is "Ruach"? Rabbi Yochanan said: The spirit of Naboth the Jezreelite.

hebrew_text: הֲוָה לֵיהּ לְמֵידַק כִּדְרַבִּי יִצְחָק דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק סִיגְנוֹן אֶחָד עוֹלֶה לְכַמָּה נְבִיאִים וְאֵין שְׁנֵי נְבִיאִים מִתְנַבְּאִין בְּסִיגְנוֹן אֶחָד
human_translation: It was upon to discern in accordance with of Rabbi Yitzḥak, as Rabbi Yitzḥak says: one subject matter [ sigenon ] may appear to several prophets, but two prophets do not prophesy one style
llm_translation: He had a louse like Rabbi Yitzchak who said Rabbi Yitzchak: "One sign goes up to how many prophets, and two prophets do not prophesy on one sign."

hebrew_text: עוֹבַדְיָה אָמַר זְדוֹן לִבְּךָ הִשִּׁיאֶךָ יִרְמְיָה אָמַר תִּפְלַצְתְּךָ הִשִּׁיא אֹתָךְ זְדוֹן לִבֶּךָ וְהָנֵי מִדְּקָאָמְרִי כּוּלְּהוּ כַּהֲדָדֵי שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ לָא כְּלוּם קָאָמְרִי
human_translation: Obadiah said: “The pride of your heart has beguiled you” Jeremiah said “Your terribleness has deceived you, even the pride of your heart” And these from that all are saying like each other, conclude from it they are saying nothing
llm_translation: Ovadyah said: "Zedon misled your heart." Yirmiyah said: "Your licentiousness misled you." Zedon misled your heart, and these are the words they said: "All of them, like Hadadei, do not listen to her; they said nothing."

hebrew_text: דִּילְמָא לָא הֲוָה יָדַע לֵיהּ לְהָא דְּרַבִּי יִצְחָק יְהוֹשָׁפָט הֲוָה הָתָם וְקָאָמַר לְהוּ דִּכְתִיב וַיֹּאמֶר יְהוֹשָׁפָט הַאֵין פֹּה נָבִיא עוֹד לַה' אֲמַר לֵיהּ הָא אִיכָּא כֹּל הָנֵי אֲמַר לֵיהּ כָּךְ מְקוּבְּלַנִי מִבֵּית אֲבִי אַבָּא סִיגְנוֹן אֶחָד עוֹלֶה לְכַמָּה נְבִיאִים וְאֵין שְׁנֵי נְבִיאִים מִתְנַבְּאִים בְּסִיגְנוֹן אֶחָד
human_translation: Perhaps did not know this of Rabbi Yitzḥak, Jehoshaphat, was there, and he said to them as it is written: “But Jehoshaphat said: Is there not here besides a prophet of the Lord, said to him: But aren’t there all these said to This is I received from the house of the father of my father, one subject matter may appear to several prophets, but two prophets do not prophesy one style
llm_translation: Perhaps he did not know the statement of Rabbi Yitzchak Yehoshafat was there, and he was there and said to them, as it is written, "And Yehoshafat said, 'Is there no longer a prophet of the Lord here?'" He said to him, "Is there not all of these?" He said to him, "This is how I have received it from the house of my father's father: One Siggnon goes up to how many prophets, and two prophets do not prophesy in one Siggnon."

hebrew_text: הַמִּתְנַבֵּא מַה שֶּׁלֹּא נֶאֱמַר לוֹ  כְּגוֹן חֲנַנְיָה בֶּן עַזּוּר דְּקָאֵי יִרְמְיָה בְּשׁוּק הָעֶלְיוֹן וְקָאָמַר כֹּה אָמַר ה' [צְבָאוֹת] הִנְנִי שֹׁבֵר אֶת קֶשֶׁת עֵילָם נָשָׂא חֲנַנְיָה קַל וָחוֹמֶר בְּעַצְמוֹ מָה עֵילָם שֶׁלֹּא בָּא אֶלָּא לַעֲזוֹר אֶת בָּבֶל אָמַר הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא הִנְנִי שֹׁבֵר אֶת קֶשֶׁת עֵילָם כַּשְׂדִּים עַצְמָן עַל אַחַת כַּמָּה וְכַמָּה אֲתָא אִיהוּ בְּשׁוּק הַתַּחְתּוֹן אֲמַר כֹּה אָמַר ה' וְגוֹ' שָׁבַרְתִּי אֶת עֹל מֶלֶךְ בָּבֶל
human_translation: one who prophesies that which was not stated to him. For example, Hananiah, son of Azzur, as Jeremiah was standing in the upper market and saying: “So says the Lord of hosts: Behold, I will break the bow of Elam, Hananiah raised an a fortiori himself: If, Elam, which came only to assist Babylonia, the Holy One, Blessed be He, said: “Behold, I will break the bow of Elam,” all the more so the Chaldeans, themselves, came to the lower market said: “So speaks the Lord I have broken the yoke of the king of Babylon”
llm_translation: The one who prophesies what was not said to him, like Hananiah son of Azzur, who stood by Jeremiah in the upper market, and said, "Thus says the Lord of Hosts: Behold, I will break the bow of Elam." Hananiah inferred a fortiori: If Elam, which only came to help Babylon, the Holy One, blessed be He, said, "Behold, I will break the bow of Elam," how much more so the Chaldeans themselves! How much more so! He then came to the lower market and said, "Thus says the Lord: I have broken the yoke of the king of Babylon."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב פָּפָּא לְאַבָּיֵי הַאי לַחֲבֵירוֹ נָמֵי לֹא נֶאֱמַר אֲמַר לֵיהּ כֵּיוָן דְּאִיתְיְהִיב קַל וָחוֹמֶר לְמִידְרַשׁ כְּמַאן דְּאִיתְּמַר לֵיהּ דָּמֵי הוּא נִיהוּ דְּלֹא נֶאֱמַר לוֹ
human_translation: Rav Pappa said to Abaye: neither was this stated to another said to him: Since can be inferred an a fortiori it is like that was said to as it was not stated to him,
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Papa to Abbaye: "This to his friend is also not stated." He said to him: "Since he gave a fortiori argument for a homily, it is like one to whom it was said that it is similar, that it was not stated to him."

hebrew_text: הַמִּתְנַבֵּא בְּשֵׁם עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה  כְּגוֹן נְבִיאֵי הַבַּעַל
human_translation: one who prophesies in the name of idol worship. For example, the prophets of the Baal
llm_translation: One who prophesies in the name of idolatry, such as the prophets of Baal.

hebrew_text: הַכּוֹבֵשׁ אֶת נְבוּאָתוֹ  כְּגוֹן יוֹנָה בֶּן אֲמִיתַּי וְהַמְוַותֵּר עַל דִּבְרֵי נָבִיא  כְּגוֹן
human_translation: one who suppresses his prophecy. For example, Jonah, son of Amittai And one who forgoes the statement of a prophet. For example,
llm_translation: The one who suppresses his prophecy, such as Jonah son of Amittai, and the one who is lenient regarding the words of a prophet, such as

hebrew_text: חַבְרֵיהּ דְּמִיכָה דִּכְתִיב וְאִישׁ אֶחָד מִבְּנֵי הַנְּבִיאִים אָמַר אֶל רֵעֵהוּ בִּדְבַר ה' הַכֵּינִי נָא וַיְמָאֵן הָאִישׁ לְהַכּוֹתוֹ וּכְתִיב וַיֹּאמֶר לוֹ יַעַן אֲשֶׁר לֹא שָׁמַעְתָּ [וְגוֹ']
human_translation: the colleague of Micah, as it is written: “And a certain man of the sons of the prophets said unto his colleague by the word of the Lord: Strike me, please. And the man refused to strike him” And it is written: “Then he said he to him: Because you have not listened
llm_translation: His colleagues of Mica, as it is written, "And one man from the sons of the prophets said to his friend, 'Strike me, please,' but the man refused to strike him. And it is written, 'Because you did not listen etc..'"

hebrew_text: וְנָבִיא שֶׁעָבַר עַל דִּבְרֵי עַצְמוֹ  כְּגוֹן עִדּוֹ הַנָּבִיא דִּכְתִיב כִּי כֵן צִוָּה אֹתִי וּכְתִיב וַיֹּאמֶר לוֹ גַּם אֲנִי נָבִיא כָּמוֹךָ וּכְתִיב וַיָּשׇׁב אִתּוֹ וּכְתִיב וַיֵּלֶךְ וַיִּמְצָאֵהוּ אַרְיֵה
human_translation: And a prophet who violated his own statement. For example, Iddo the prophet, as it is written: for it so was commanded me And it is written: “And he said to him: I too am a prophet like you; And it is written: “And he went back with him, And it is written “And he went, and a lion met him
llm_translation: And a prophet who transgressed his own words, such as the witness prophet, as it is written, "For so he commanded me," and it is written, "And he said to him, 'I too am a prophet like you,'" and it is written, "And he returned with him," and it is written, "And a lion found him."

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי תַּנָּא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב חִסְדָּא הַכּוֹבֵשׁ אֶת נְבוּאָתוֹ לוֹקֶה אָמַר לֵיהּ מַאן דְּאָכֵיל תַּמְרֵי בְּאַרְבְּלָא לָקֵי מַאן מַתְרֵי בֵּיהּ אָמַר אַבָּיֵי חַבְרֵיהּ נְבִיאֵי
human_translation: A tanna taught before Rav Ḥisda: One who suppresses his prophecy is flogged. said to him: Is one who eats dates in a sieve flogged? Who forewarns him Abaye said: His fellow prophets
llm_translation: The Tanna taught before Rav Ḥisda: One who suppresses his prophecy is struck. He said to him: Whoever eats dates with barley is struck. Who is exempt from being struck? Abaye said: His fellow prophets.

hebrew_text: מְנָא יָדְעִי אָמַר אַבָּיֵי דִּכְתִיב כִּי לֹא יַעֲשֶׂה ה' [אֱלֹהִים] דָּבָר כִּי אִם גָּלָה סוֹדוֹ וְדִילְמָא הֲדַרוּ בֵּיהּ אִם אִיתָא דְּהָדְרִי בֵּיהּ  אוֹדוֹעֵי הֲווֹ מוֹדְעִי לְכֻלְּהוּ נְבִיאֵי
human_translation: From where do they know Abaye says: as it is written: “For the Lord God will do nothing, unless He reveals His counsel And perhaps reconsidered with regard to If it is so that they reconsidered with regard to would have informed all the prophets.
llm_translation: Mena Yadi Amar Abaye, dikhtiv "ki lo ya'aseh Hashem Elohim davar ki im galah sodo, vedilma hadaru bei im ita dehadri bei, odoei havu modoei lekullehu neviyei."

hebrew_text: וְהָא יוֹנָה דַּהֲדַרוּ בֵּיהּ וְלָא אוֹדְעוּהּ יוֹנָה מֵעִיקָּרָא נִינְוֵה נֶהְפָּכֶת אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ אִיהוּ לָא יְדַע אִי לְטוֹבָה אִי לְרָעָה
human_translation: But Jonah, they reconsidered it and did not inform them Jonah, from the outset, told him “Nineveh will be overturned” he did not know if for the good, or for the bad,
llm_translation: And the dove that returned to it, and they did not recognize it, the dove from the beginning, Nineveh has turned. They said to it, "He does not know whether for good or for evil."

hebrew_text: הַמְוַותֵּר עַל דִּבְרֵי נָבִיא מְנָא יָדַע דְּאִיעֲנַשׁ דִּיהַב לֵיהּ אוֹת וְהָא מִיכָה דְּלָא יְהַב לֵיהּ אוֹת וְאִיעֲנַשׁ הֵיכָא דְּמוּחְזָק שָׁאנֵי
human_translation: one who forgoes the statement of a prophet, from where does he know that he punished where provides him a sign But Micah, who did not provide him a sign, and punished, where assumed presumptive status is different,
llm_translation: The one who is permitted regarding the words of a prophet, from where does he know that he will be punished? Because he gave him a sign. But as for Micha, who did not give him a sign, and he was punished, where is it that he was firmly established?

hebrew_text: דְּאִי לָא תֵּימָא הָכִי אַבְרָהָם בְּהַר הַמּוֹרִיָּה הֵיכִי שְׁמַע לֵיהּ יִצְחָק אֵלִיָּהוּ בְּהַר הַכַּרְמֶל הֵיכִי סָמְכִי עֲלֵיהּ וְעָבְדִי שְׁחוּטֵי חוּץ אֶלָּא הֵיכָא דְּמוּחְזָק שָׁאנֵי
human_translation: Since if you do not say so, Abraham at Mount Moriah, how did Isaac listen to him Elijah at Mount Carmel, how did rely upon him and engage slaughtered outside Rather, where assumed presumptive status is different.
llm_translation: If you don't say so, how did Abraham on Mount Moriah listen to Isaac? Elijah on Mount Carmel, how did he rely on it and perform the slaughter of sacrifices outside? Rather, it must be in a place where it is firmly established.

hebrew_text: וַיְהִי אַחַר הַדְּבָרִים הָאֵלֶּה וְהָאֱלֹהִים נִסָּה אֶת אַבְרָהָם אַחֵר מַאי
human_translation: “And it came to pass after these matters [ hadevarim ] that God tried Abraham” After what
llm_translation: And it was after these things, and God tested Abraham, after what.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בֶּן זִימְרָא אַחַר דְּבָרָיו שֶׁל שָׂטָן דִּכְתִיב וַיִּגְדַּל הַיֶּלֶד וַיִּגָּמַל וְגוֹ' אָמַר שָׂטָן לִפְנֵי הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם זָקֵן זֶה חֲנַנְתּוֹ לְמֵאָה שָׁנָה פְּרִי בֶטֶן מִכׇּל סְעוּדָה שֶׁעָשָׂה לֹא הָיָה לוֹ תּוֹר אֶחָד אוֹ גּוֹזָל אֶחָד לְהַקְרִיב לְפָנֶיךָ אָמַר לוֹ כְּלוּם עָשָׂה אֶלָּא בִּשְׁבִיל בְּנוֹ אִם אֲנִי אוֹמֵר לוֹ 'זְבַח אֶת בִּנְךָ לְפָנַי'  מִיָּד זוֹבְחוֹ מִיָּד וְהָאֱלֹהִים נִסָּה אֶת אַבְרָהָם
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said in the name of Rabbi Yosei ben Zimra: after the statement [ devarav ] of Satan, as it is written: “And the child grew, and was weaned, Satan said before the Holy One, Blessed be He: Master of the Universe, this old man, you favored him with a product of the womb, at one hundred years From the entire feast that he prepared, did he not have one dove or one pigeon to sacrifice before You said to Did prepare but for his son? If I say to him: Sacrifice your son before Me, immediately slaughter him. Immediately, “And God tried Abraham.”
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said in the name of Rabbi Yosei ben Zimra: After the words of the Satan, as it is written, "And the child grew and was weaned, etc." The Satan said before the Holy One, blessed be He: "Master of the world, this old man You have favored for a hundred years, from all the meals he made, he did not have one fetus or one young bird to offer before You." He said to him, "He did nothing except for his son. If I were to say to him, 'Sacrifice your son before Me,' he would immediately sacrifice him." And God tested Abraham.

hebrew_text: וַיֹּאמֶר קַח נָא אֶת בִּנְךָ אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בַּר אַבָּא אֵין נָא אֶלָּא לְשׁוֹן בַּקָּשָׁה  מָשָׁל לְמֶלֶךְ בָּשָׂר וָדָם שֶׁעָמְדוּ עָלָיו מִלְחָמוֹת הַרְבֵּה וְהָיָה לוֹ גִּבּוֹר אֶחָד וְנִצְּחָן לְיָמִים עָמְדָה עָלָיו מִלְחָמָה חֲזָקָה אָמַר לוֹ בְּבַקָּשָׁה מִמְּךָ עֲמוֹד לִי בְּמִלְחָמָה זוֹ שֶׁלֹּא יֹאמְרוּ רִאשׁוֹנוֹת אֵין בָּהֶם מַמָּשׁ אַף הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא אָמַר לְאַבְרָהָם נִיסֵּיתִיךָ בְּכַמָּה נִסְיוֹנוֹת וְעָמַדְתָּ בְּכֻלָּן עַכְשָׁיו עֲמוֹד לִי בְּנִסָּיוֹן זֶה שֶׁלֹּא יֹאמְרוּ אֵין מַמָּשׁ בָּרִאשׁוֹנִים
human_translation: “And He said: Take, please [ na ], your son” Rabbi Shimon bar Abba says: na is nothing other than an expression of entreaty. a parable of a flesh-and-blood king who confronted many wars. And he had one warrior and he overcame Over time, a fierce war confronting him. said to I entreat you, stand for me in this war, that will not say: There is no substance in the first the Holy One, Blessed be He, also said to Abraham: I have tried you with several ordeals, and you have withstood them all. Now, stand in this ordeal for Me, so that will not say: There is no substance in the first
llm_translation: And he said, "Please take your son." Rabbi Shimon bar Abba said: "Please" is only an expression of difficulty. A parable: To a king of flesh and blood who faced many wars, and he had one mighty warrior who would prevail for days. Another strong war came upon him, he said to him, "Please, stand for me in this battle, so that the earlier ones will not say they lacked substance." So too, the Holy One, blessed be He, said to Abraham, "I have tested you with many trials, and you have withstood them all. Now stand for me in this trial, so that they will not say the earlier ones lacked substance."

hebrew_text: אֶת בִּנְךָ  שְׁנֵי בָּנִים יֵשׁ לִי אֶת יְחִידְךָ  זֶה יָחִיד לְאִמּוֹ וְזֶה יָחִיד לְאִמּוֹ אֲשֶׁר אָהַבְתָּ  תַּרְוַיְיהוּ רָחֵימְנָא לְהוּ אֶת יִצְחָק וְכׇל כָּךְ לָמָּה  כְּדֵי שֶׁלֹּא תִּטָּרֵף דַּעְתּוֹ עָלָיו
human_translation: “Your son,” I have two sons. “Your only,” This is an only to his mother, and that is an only to his mother. “Whom you love,” I love both of them. “Isaac.” And why that extent? so that mind would not be confused
llm_translation: Your son, two sons I have; your only one, this one is the only one to his mother, and this one is the only one to his mother, whom you loved. We are compassionate towards both of them, towards Isaac, and all this - why? So that his mind will not be torn over him.

hebrew_text: קְדָמוֹ שָׂטָן לַדֶּרֶךְ אָמַר לוֹ הֲנִסָּה דָבָר אֵלֶיךָ תִּלְאֶה הִנֵּה יִסַּרְתָּ רַבִּים וְיָדַיִם רָפוֹת תְּחַזֵּק כּוֹשֵׁל יְקִימוּן מִלֶּיךָ כִּי עַתָּה תָּבוֹא אֵלֶיךָ וַתֵּלֶא אָמַר לוֹ אֲנִי בְּתֻמִּי אֵלֵךְ
human_translation: Satan preceded to the path said to him: “If one ventures a word to you, will you be weary…you have instructed many, and you have strengthened the weak hands. Your words have upheld him that was falling…but now it comes upon you, and you are weary” said to him I will walk with my integrity”
llm_translation: The adversary went ahead on the road, he said to him, "Have you tried my word to you? Delay, behold, you have weakened many, and weak hands you shall strengthen. Stumbling they shall rise from you, for now they shall come to you, and you shall delay." He said to him, "I will go in my integrity."

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ הֲלֹא יִרְאָתְךָ כִּסְלָתֶךָ אָמַר לוֹ זְכׇר נָא מִי הוּא נָקִי אָבָד כֵּיוָן דַּחֲזָא דְּלָא קָא שָׁמַיע לֵיהּ אֲמַר לֵיהּ וְאֵלַי דָּבָר יְגֻנָּב כָּךְ שָׁמַעְתִּי מֵאֲחוֹרֵי הַפַּרְגּוֹד הַשֶּׂה לְעוֹלָה וְאֵין יִצְחָק לְעוֹלָה אָמַר לוֹ כָּךְ עוֹנְשׁוֹ שֶׁל בַּדַּאי שֶׁאֲפִילּוּ אָמַר אֱמֶת אֵין שׁוֹמְעִין לוֹ
human_translation: said to “Is not your fear of God your foolishness?” said to him: “Remember, please, whoever perished, being innocent” Once saw that was not heeding him, he said to him: “Now a word was secretly brought to me, This I heard from behind the curtain [ pargod ], The sheep is to a burnt-offering, and Isaac is not to a burnt-offering. said to him: this is the punishment of the liar, that even he speaks the truth, do not listen to him.
llm_translation: He said to him, "Is not your fear like your foolishness?" He said to him, "Remember now who is innocent perishes. Once he saw that he did not accept his reproof, he said to him, "But I heard that a matter was stolen behind the partition of the ram for the burnt offering, and Isaac is not for the burnt offering." He said to him, "This is the punishment of a presumptuous person, that even if he speaks the truth, they do not listen to him."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי לֵוִי אָמַר אַחַר דְּבָרָיו שֶׁל יִשְׁמָעֵאל לְיִצְחָק אָמַר לוֹ יִשְׁמָעֵאל לְיִצְחָק אֲנִי גָּדוֹל מִמְּךָ בְּמִצְוֹת שֶׁאַתָּה מַלְתָּ בֶּן שְׁמֹנַת יָמִים וַאֲנִי בֶּן שְׁלֹשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה שָׁנָה אָמַר לוֹ וּבְאֵבֶר אֶחָד אַתָּה מְגָרֶה בִּי אִם אוֹמֵר לִי הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא 'זְבַח עַצְמְךָ לְפָנַי' אֲנִי זוֹבֵחַ מִיָּד וְהָאֱלֹהִים נִסָּה אֶת אַבְרָהָם
human_translation: Rabbi Levi says: after the statement of Ishmael to Isaac, Ishmael said to Isaac: I am greater than you in mitzvot, as you were circumcised age of eight days, and I age of thirteen years, said to And do you provoke me with one organ? If the Holy One, Blessed be He, say to me: Sacrifice yourself before Me, I sacrifice Immediately, God tried Abraham,
llm_translation: Rabbi Levi said, after the words of Yishmael to Yitzchak, Yishmael said to him, "I am greater than you in mitzvot, for you were circumcised at eight days old, and I am thirteen years old." He said to him, "But with one limb you provoke me? If the Holy One, blessed be He, were to say to me, 'Sacrifice yourself before Me,' I would sacrifice immediately, and God tested Abraham."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן נָבִיא שֶׁהִדִּיחַ בִּסְקִילָה רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר בְּחֶנֶק מַדִּיחֵי עִיר הַנִּדַּחַת בִּסְקִילָה רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר בְּחֶנֶק
human_translation: The Sages taught: A prophet who incites by stoning. Rabbi Shimon says: by strangulation. who incite an idolatrous city, by stoning. Rabbi Shimon says: by strangulation.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: A prophet who misled the people to stoning. Rabbi Shimon says: He is punished by strangulation. Those who mislead a city to idolatry to stoning. Rabbi Shimon says: They are punished by strangulation.

hebrew_text: נָבִיא שֶׁהִדִּיחַ בִּסְקִילָה מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבָּנַן  אָתְיָא הַדָּחָה הַדָּחָה מִמֵּסִית מָה לְהַלָּן בִּסְקִילָה  אַף כָּאן בִּסְקִילָה
human_translation: A prophet who incites by stoning. What is the reason of the Rabbis? derive incitement from incitement instigates Just as there, by stoning, so too here, by stoning.
llm_translation: Prophet who misled to stoning what reason of sages come exclusion exclusion from enticer what to there in stoning also here in stoning

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן מִיתָה כְּתִיבָא בֵּיהּ וְכׇל מִיתָה הָאֲמוּרָה בְּתוֹרָה סְתָם אֵינָהּ אֶלָּא חֶנֶק
human_translation: And Rabbi Shimon death is written concerning him. And every death stated in the Torah without specification nothing other than strangulation.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon died as it is written in it, and any death mentioned in the Torah is only by strangulation.

hebrew_text: מַדִּיחֵי עִיר הַנִּדַּחַת בִּסְקִילָה מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבָּנַן  גְּמִירִי הַדָּחָה הַדָּחָה אוֹ מִמֵּסִית אוֹ מִנָּבִיא שֶׁהִדִּיחַ
human_translation: who incite an idolatrous city, by stoning. What is the reason of the Rabbis? They derive incitement from incitement either instigates or from a prophet who incites
llm_translation: Discussers of a city that has been led astray to stoning, what is the reason of the Rabbis? They have learned that the leading astray is either from a seducer, or from a false prophet who led astray.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן גָּמַר הַדָּחָה הַדָּחָה מִנָּבִיא
human_translation: And Rabbi Shimon derives incitement from incitement a prophet
llm_translation: And Rabbi Shimon concluded: "Rejection, rejection is from the prophet."

hebrew_text: וְלִיגְמַר מִמֵּסִית דָּנִין מֵסִית רַבִּים מִמֵּסִית רַבִּים וְאֵין דָּנִין מֵסִית רַבִּים מִמֵּסִית יָחִיד אַדְּרַבָּה דָּנִין הֶדְיוֹט מֵהֶדְיוֹט וְאֵין דָּנִין הֶדְיוֹט מִנָּבִיא
human_translation: Let him derive from instigates derives instigates the multitudes from instigates the multitudes, and does not derive instigates the multitudes from instigates an individual. On the contrary, one derives an ordinary from an ordinary and one does not derive an ordinary from a prophet
llm_translation: And to conclude from a case of a single individual, they judge a single individual; from a case of the many, they judge the many. And they do not judge the many from a case of a single individual. The general principle is: they judge a layman against a layman, and they do not judge a layman against a prophet.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן כֵּיוָן שֶׁהִדִּיחַ  אֵין לְךָ הֶדְיוֹט גָּדוֹל מִזֶּה
human_translation: And Rabbi Shimon once incited you have no greater an ordinary than that.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon: Since he reasoned, "There is no greater commoner than this."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda says:
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda said:

hebrew_text: מַחְלוֹקֶת בְּעוֹקֵר הַגּוּף דַּעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה וְקִיּוּם מִקְצָת וּבִיטּוּל מִקְצָת דַּעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה דְּרַחֲמָנָא אָמַר מִן הַדֶּרֶךְ  אֲפִילּוּ מִקְצָת הַדֶּרֶךְ
human_translation: The dispute is with regard to abolish the essence of idol worship, or fulfillment part of and nullification part of of idol worship, as the Merciful One says: from the way even part of the way.
llm_translation: Dispute regarding uprooting the body of foreign worship and partial fulfillment and partial annulment of foreign worship, for the Merciful One said "from the path" even a portion of the path.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל עוֹקֵר הַגּוּף דִּשְׁאָר מִצְוֹת  דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל בְּחֶנֶק וְקִיּוּם מִקְצָת וּבִיטּוּל מִקְצָת דְּבִשְׁאָר מִצְוֹת  דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל פָּטוּר
human_translation: But abolishes the essence of rest of mitzvot, everyone agrees by strangulation. And fulfillment of part and nullification of part of other mitzvot, everyone agrees exempt
llm_translation: But uprooting the body, regarding the rest of the commandments, the words of all are in strangulation and partial fulfillment and partial annulment, regarding the rest of the commandments, the words of all are exempt.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַב הַמְנוּנָא 'לָלֶכֶת'  זוֹ מִצְוַת עֲשֵׂה 'בָּהּ'  זוֹ מִצְוַת לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה וְאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ בַּעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה עֲשֵׂה בַּעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה הֵיכִי מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ תַּרְגְּמַהּ רַב חִסְדָּא וְנִתַּצְתֶּם
human_translation: Rav Hamnuna raises an objection “To walk”; this a positive mitzva. “On which”; this a prohibition. And if it enters your mind with regard to idol worship, how can you find a positive mitzva idol worship? Rav Ḥisda interpreted “And you shall smash
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: Rav Hamnuna raised a contradiction: "To go" - this is a positive commandment, "in it" - this is a negative commandment. And if you were to suggest that your intention is in the context of foreign worship, perform it in the context of foreign worship. How do you find it? Translate it, Rav Ḥisda, and you will be uprooted.

hebrew_text: רַב הַמְנוּנָא אָמַר מַחֲלוֹקֶת בְּעוֹקֵר הַגּוּף בֵּין בַּעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה בֵּין בִּשְׁאָר מִצְוֹת וְקִיּוּם מִקְצָת וּבִיטּוּל מִקְצָת דַּעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה דְּרַחֲמָנָא אָמַר מִן הַדֶּרֶךְ אֲפִילּוּ מִקְצָת הַדֶּרֶךְ
human_translation: Rav Hamnuna says: The dispute is with regard to abolish the essence whether with regard to idol worship or with regard to rest of mitzvot; or fulfillment part of and nullification part of of idol worship. as the Merciful One says: “From the way,” even part of the way.
llm_translation: Rav Hamnuna said: Dispute in uprooting the body, whether in idol worship or in other commandments, and in fulfilling some and nullifying some. Regarding idol worship, for the Merciful One said, "from the way, even a part of the way."

hebrew_text: אֲבָל קִיּוּם מִקְצָת וּבִיטּוּל מִקְצָת דְּבִשְׁאָר מִצְוֹת  דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל פָּטוּר
human_translation: But fulfillment of part and nullification of part of other mitzvot, everyone agrees exempt
llm_translation: However, fulfillment of some and nullification of some, regarding other commandments, all agree one is exempt.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן הַמִּתְנַבֵּא לַעֲקוֹר דָּבָר מִן הַתּוֹרָה  חַיָּיב לְקַיֵּים מִקְצָת וּלְבַטֵּל מִקְצָת  רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן פּוֹטֵר וּבַעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה אֲפִילּוּ אוֹמֵר 'הַיּוֹם עִיבְדוּהָ וּלְמָחָר בַּטְּלוּהָ'  דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל חַיָּיב
human_translation: The Sages taught: one who prophesies to abolish a matter from the Torah, liable to fulfill part or to nullify part Rabbi Shimon deems exempt And with regard to idol worship, even says: Worship it today and tomorrow nullify it, everyone agrees liable.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: One who prophesies to uproot something from the Torah is obligated to fulfill some and annul some. Rabbi Shimon exempts him, and in idolatry, even if one says, "Today worship it, and tomorrow annul it," everyone agrees that he is liable.

hebrew_text: אַבָּיֵי סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַב חִסְדָּא וּמְתָרֵץ לַהּ כְּרַב חִסְדָּא רָבָא סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַב הַמְנוּנָא וּמְתָרֵץ לַהּ כְּרַב הַמְנוּנָא
human_translation: Abaye holds in accordance with Rav Ḥisda and explains in accordance with Rav Ḥisda. Rava holds in accordance with Rav Hamnuna and explains in accordance with Rav Hamnuna.
llm_translation: Abaye thought like Rav Ḥisda and resolved it like Rav Ḥisda. Rava thought like Rav Hamnuna and resolved it like Rav Hamnuna.

hebrew_text: אַבָּיֵי סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַב חִסְדָּא וּמְתָרֵץ לַהּ כְּרַב חִסְדָּא הַמִּתְנַבֵּא לַעֲקוֹר דָּבָר מִן הַתּוֹרָה  דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל בְּחֶנֶק לְקַיֵּים מִקְצָת וּלְבַטֵּל מִקְצָת  רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן פּוֹטֵר וְהוּא הַדִּין לְרַבָּנַן וּבַעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה אֲפִילּוּ אָמַר הַיּוֹם עִיבְדוּהָ וּלְמָחָר בַּטְּלוּהָ  חַיָּיב מָר כִּדְאִית לֵיהּ וּמַר כִּדְאִית לֵיהּ
human_translation: Abaye holds in accordance with Rav Ḥisda and explains in accordance with Rav Ḥisda. one who prophesies to abolish a matter from the Torah, everyone agrees by strangulation. to fulfill part or to nullify part Rabbi Shimon deems exempt and the same is true of the Rabbis, And with regard to idol worship, even if he says: Worship it today and nullify it tomorrow, liable Sage, in accordance with he holds, and Sage, in accordance with he holds,
llm_translation: Abaye holds like Rav Ḥisda and interprets for her like Rav Ḥisda: One who prophesies to uproot a matter from the Torah, everyone agrees that he is liable to fulfill part of it and to annul part of it. Rabbi Shimon exempts, and the same applies to the Rabbis. In the case of idol worship, even if one said, "Serve it today," and the next day, "Annul it," the master is liable according to his statement, and the master is liable according to his statement.

hebrew_text: רָבָא סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַב הַמְנוּנָא וּמְתָרֵץ לַהּ כְּרַב הַמְנוּנָא הַמִּתְנַבֵּא לַעֲקוֹר דָּבָר מִן הַתּוֹרָה בֵּין בַּעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה בֵּין בִּשְׁאָר מִצְוֹת  חַיָּיב מָר כִּדְאִית לֵיהּ וּמַר כִּדְאִית לֵיהּ לְקַיֵּים מִקְצָת וּלְבַטֵּל מִקְצָת בִּשְׁאָר מִצְוֹת  רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן פּוֹטֵר וְהוּא הַדִּין לְרַבָּנַן וּבַעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה אֲפִילּוּ אוֹמֵר הַיּוֹם עִיבְדוּהָ וּלְמָחָר בַּטְּלוּהָ  חַיָּיב מָר כִּדְאִית לֵיהּ וּמַר כִּדְאִית לֵיהּ
human_translation: Rava holds in accordance with Rav Hamnuna and explains in accordance with Rav Hamnuna. one who prophesies to abolish a matter from the Torah, whether with regard to idol worship or with regard to rest of mitzvot, liable Sage, in accordance with he holds, and Sage, in accordance with he holds, to fulfill part or to nullify part Rabbi Shimon deems exempt and the same is true of the Rabbis, And with regard to idol worship, even he says: Worship it today and nullify it tomorrow, liable Sage, in accordance with he holds, and Sage, in accordance with he holds,
llm_translation: Rava holds like Rav Hamnuna and interprets like Rav Hamnuna who prophesied to uproot a matter from the Torah, whether in idol worship or in other commandments, one is liable. Mar is as he is, and Mar is as he is, to fulfill some and nullify some in other commandments. Rabbi Shimon exempts, and the same applies to the Rabbis. In idol worship, even if one says, "Today we should worship it," and tomorrow "we should nullify it," one is liable. Mar is as he is, and Mar is as he is.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בַּכֹּל אִם יֹאמַר לְךָ נָבִיא עֲבוֹר עַל דִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה  שְׁמַע לוֹ חוּץ מֵעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה שֶׁאֲפִילּוּ מַעֲמִיד לְךָ חַמָּה בְּאֶמְצַע הָרָקִיעַ  אַל תִּשְׁמַע לוֹ תַּנְיָא רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי אוֹמֵר הִגִּיעָה תּוֹרָה לְסוֹף דַּעְתָּהּ שֶׁל עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה לְפִיכָךְ נָתְנָה תּוֹרָה מֶמְשָׁלָה בָּהּ שֶׁאֲפִילּוּ מַעֲמִיד לְךָ חַמָּה בְּאֶמְצַע הָרָקִיעַ  אַל תִּשְׁמַע לוֹ
human_translation: Rabbi Abbahu says Rabbi Yoḥanan says, With regard to all if a prophet will say to you: Violate matters of Torah heed him, except for idol worship, as even stops the sun for you in the middle of the sky, do not heed him. It is taught Rabbi Yosei HaGelili says: The Torah ascertained the depth of the mentality of idol worship, Therefore, the Torah ascribed dominion in its even stops the sun for you in the middle of the sky, do not heed him.
llm_translation: Rabbi Avahu said, Rabbi Yochanan said: In all things, if a prophet says to you to transgress the words of the Torah, listen to him, except regarding idol worship. Even if he places the sun in the middle of the sky for you, do not listen to him. It was taught in a baraita: Rabbi Yosei the Galilean says, the Torah has reached the limit of its knowledge concerning idol worship. Therefore, the Torah has given a parable about it, that even if he places the sun in the middle of the sky for you, do not listen to him.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא אָמַר רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא חַס וְשָׁלוֹם שֶׁהַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא מַעֲמִיד חַמָּה לְעוֹבְרֵי רְצוֹנוֹ אֶלָּא כְּגוֹן חֲנַנְיָה בֶּן עַזּוּר שֶׁמִּתְּחִלָּתוֹ נְבִיא אֱמֶת וּלְבַסּוֹף נְבִיא שֶׁקֶר
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Akiva says: Heaven forfend that the Holy One, Blessed be He, stop the sun for violate His will. Rather, for example, Hananiah, son of Azzur, whose origin a true prophet, and ultimately, a false prophet.
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Akiva said, may peace be upon him, that the Holy One, blessed be He, appoints the sun for those who do His will. For example, like Chananiah ben Azur, whose beginning was as a true prophet, and in the end as a false prophet.

hebrew_text: וְזוֹמְמֵי בַּת כֹּהֵן מְנָהָנֵי מִילֵּי אָמַר רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִיקָא דְּתַנְיָא רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר 'וַעֲשִׂיתֶם לוֹ כַּאֲשֶׁר זָמַם לַעֲשׂוֹת לְאֶחָיו'  לְפִי שֶׁכׇּל הַמְזוּמָּמִין שֶׁבַּתּוֹרָה זוֹמְמֵיהֶן וּבוֹעֲלֵיהֶן כַּיּוֹצֵא בָּהֶן
human_translation: And conspiring the daughter of a priest From where are these matters Rav Aḥa, son of Rav Ika, says: as it is taught Rabbi Yosei says: What the verse states “And you shall do to him as he conspired to do to his brother” due to that all rendered conspiring who are in the Torah, their conspiring and their paramours are similar
llm_translation: Accusers of the daughter of a Kohen who are found to be plotting, Rav Acha, son of Rav Ika, taught in a Baraita: Rabbi Yosei says, "What is the meaning of the verse, 'And you shall do to him as he plotted to do to his brother'? This teaches that anyone who plots evil in the Torah, his plots will be turned back upon him."

hebrew_text: בַּת כֹּהֵן הִיא בִּשְׂרֵיפָה וְאֵין בּוֹעֲלָהּ בִּשְׂרֵיפָה זוֹמְמִין אֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ אִם לוֹ הוּקְשׁוּ אִם לָהּ הוּקְשׁוּ כְּשֶׁהוּא אוֹמֵר לַעֲשׂוֹת לְאָחִיו לְאָחִיו וְלֹא לַאֲחוֹתוֹ
human_translation: The daughter of a priest she by burning and her paramour is not by burning. conspiring I do not know if the are likened to if are likened to When states to do to his brother,” to his brother, but not to his sister.
llm_translation: Daughter of a Kohen she is in burning and not in her husband in burning this they plot I do not know if to him it was established or to her it was established when he says to do to his brother to his brother and not to his sister.

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ אֵלּוּ הֵן הַנֶּחְנָקִין
llm_translation: We will return to you: These are the ones who are being strangled.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי' כׇּל יִשְׂרָאֵל יֵשׁ לָהֶם חֵלֶק לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וְעַמֵּךְ כֻּלָּם צַדִּיקִים לְעוֹלָם יִירְשׁוּ אָרֶץ נֵצֶר מַטָּעַי מַעֲשֵׂה יָדַי לְהִתְפָּאֵר וְאֵלּוּ שֶׁאֵין לָהֶם חֵלֶק לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא הָאוֹמֵר אֵין תְּחִיַּית הַמֵּתִים מִן הַתּוֹרָה וְאֵין תּוֹרָה מִן הַשָּׁמַיִם וְאֶפִּיקוֹרוֹס
human_translation: All of the Jewish people, have a share in the World-to-Come, as it is stated: “And your people also shall be all righteous, they shall inherit the land forever; the branch of My planting, the work of My hands, for My name to be glorified” And these who have no share in the World-to-Come, One who says: There is no resurrection of the dead from the Torah, and Torah not from Heaven, and an epikoros ,
llm_translation: It was taught: All Israel have a share in the World to Come, as it is stated, "And your people, all of them righteous, shall inherit the land forever; they are the branch of My planting, the work of My hands, in which I glory." And these are the ones who have no share in the World to Come: One who says that there is no resurrection of the dead derived from the Torah, and that the Torah is not from Heaven, and an Epicurean.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר אַף הַקּוֹרֵא בַּסְּפָרִים הַחִיצוֹנִים וְהַלּוֹחֵשׁ עַל הַמַּכָּה וְאוֹמֵר כׇּל הַמַּחֲלָה אֲשֶׁר שַׂמְתִּי בְמִצְרַיִם לֹא אָשִׂים עָלֶיךָ כִּי אֲנִי ה' רֹפְאֶךָ אַבָּא שָׁאוּל אוֹמֵר אַף הַהוֹגֶה אֶת הַשֵּׁם בְּאוֹתִיּוֹתָיו
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: Also one who reads external literature, and one who whispers over a wound and says “Every illness that I placed upon Egypt I will not place upon you, for I am the Lord, your Healer” Abba Shaul says: Also one who pronounces the name with its letters.
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: Even one who reads in the outer books and whispers over the wound, saying, "All the illness that I have placed in Egypt, I will not place upon you, for I am the Lord your healer." Abba Shaul says: Even one who pronounces the Name with its letters.

hebrew_text: שְׁלֹשָׁה מְלָכִים וְאַרְבָּעָה הֶדְיוֹטוֹת אֵין לָהֶן חֵלֶק לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא שְׁלֹשָׁה מְלָכִים יָרׇבְעָם אַחְאָב וּמְנַשֶּׁה רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר מְנַשֶּׁה יֵשׁ לוֹ חֵלֶק לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וַיִּתְפַּלֵּל אֵלָיו וַיִּשְׁמַע תְּחִנָּתוֹ וַיְשִׁיבֵהוּ יְרוּשָׁלִַים לְמַלְכוּתוֹ אָמְרוּ לוֹ לְמַלְכוּתוֹ הֱשִׁיבוֹ וְלֹא לְחַיֵּי הָעוֹלָם הַבָּא הֱשִׁיבוֹ אַרְבָּעָה הֶדְיוֹטוֹת בִּלְעָם וְדוֹאֵג וַאֲחִיתוֹפֶל וְגֵחֲזִי
human_translation: Three kings and four commoners have no share in the World-to-Come. three kings Jeroboam, Ahab, and Manasseh, Rabbi Yehuda says: Manasseh has a share in the World-to-Come, as it is stated “And he prayed to Him, and heard his supplication and brought him back to Jerusalem unto his kingdom” said to restored him to his kingdom, but did not restore him to his life in the World-to-Come. four commoners Balaam, Doeg Ahithophel; and Gehazi.
llm_translation: Three kings and four commoners have no portion in the World to Come. Three kings: Jeroboam, Ahab, and Manasseh. Rabbi Yehuda says: Manasseh has a portion in the World to Come, as it is stated, "And he prayed to Him, and He heard his supplication and brought him back to Jerusalem to his kingdom." They said to him: "To his kingdom He brought him back, but not to the World to Come." The four commoners: Balaam, Doeg, Ahithophel, and Gehazi.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ' וְכׇל כָּךְ לָמָּה תָּנָא הוּא כָּפַר בִּתְחִיַּית הַמֵּתִים לְפִיכָךְ לֹא יִהְיֶה לוֹ חֵלֶק בִּתְחִיַּית הַמֵּתִים שֶׁכׇּל מִדּוֹתָיו שֶׁל הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא מִדָּה כְּנֶגֶד מִדָּה
human_translation: And why to that extent taught He denied the resurrection of the dead; therefore he will not have a share in the resurrection of the dead, as all measures by the Holy One, Blessed be He, measure for measure,
llm_translation: Gemara: And all this, why did the Tanna teach? He nullified the resurrection of the dead. Therefore, he will not have a portion in the resurrection of the dead, for all the measures of the Holy One, blessed be He, are measure for measure.

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן מִנַּיִין שֶׁכׇּל מִדּוֹתָיו שֶׁל הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא מִדָּה כְּנֶגֶד מִדָּה  שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וַיֹּאמֶר אֱלִישָׁע שִׁמְעוּ דְּבַר ה' [וְגוֹ'] כָּעֵת מָחָר סְאָה סֹלֶת בְּשֶׁקֶל וְסָאתַיִם שְׂעֹרִים בְּשֶׁקֶל בְּשַׁעַר שֹׁמְרוֹן וּכְתִיב וַיַּעַן הַשָּׁלִישׁ אֲשֶׁר הַמֶּלֶךְ נִשְׁעָן עַל יָדוֹ אֶת אִישׁ הָאֱלֹהִים וַיֹּאמַר הִנֵּה ה' עוֹשֶׂה אֲרֻבּוֹת בַּשָּׁמַיִם הֲיִהְיֶה הַדָּבָר הַזֶּה וַיֹּאמֶר הִנְּךָ רֹאֶה בְּעֵינֶיךָ וּמִשָּׁם לֹא תֹאכֵל
human_translation: which Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani says Rabbi Yonatan says: From where that all measures by the Holy One, Blessed be He, measure for measure? as it is stated “And Elisha said: Hear the word of the Lord; Tomorrow at this time one se’a of fine flour will be sold for one shekel and two se’a of barley for one shekel in the gate of Samaria” And it is written: “And the officer on whose hand the king leaned answered the man of God and said: Will the Lord make windows in heaven? Might this thing be? And he said: You shall see it with your eyes, but you shall not eat from there”
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates to: "Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said in the name of Rabbi Yonatan: From where do we derive that all the attributes of the Holy One, blessed be He, are measure for measure? As it is stated, 'And Elisha said, Hear the word of the Lord etc.,' 'Tomorrow about this time a seah of fine flour will be sold for a shekel, and two seahs of barley for a shekel, in the gate of Samaria.' And it is written, 'Then the captain on whose hand the king leaned answered the man of God and said, Behold, if the Lord would make windows in heaven, might this thing be?' And he said, 'Behold, you shall see it with your eyes, but you shall not eat thereof.'"
