hebrew_text: וּכְתִיב וַיְהִי לוֹ כֵּן וַיִּרְמְסוּ אֹתוֹ הָעָם בַּשַּׁעַר וַיָּמֹת וְדִילְמָא קִלְלַת אֱלִישָׁע גְּרַמָה לֵיהּ דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב קִלְלַת חָכָם אֲפִילּוּ עַל חִנָּם הִיא בָּאָה אִם כֵּן לִכְתּוֹב קְרָא וַיִּרְמְסוּהוּ וַיָּמֹת מַאי בַּשַּׁעַר עַל עִסְקֵי שַׁעַר
human_translation: And it is written: “And it was for him so, and the people trampled him in the gate, and he died” Perhaps the curse of Elisha caused as Rav Yehuda says Rav says: The curse of a Sage, even baseless, comes If so, let the verse write: And they trampled him and he died. What “in the gate” over matters to the gate [ sha’ar ].
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it is written, "And it came to pass, as he turned back to them, that they cursed him." The people trampled him in the gate, and he died. And perhaps the curse of Elisha caused it, as Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav, "The curse of a wise man, even if it is undeserved, comes to pass." If so, let it be written, "And they trampled him, and he died." What is meant by "in the gate"? Concerning matters of the gate.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִנַּיִין לִתְחִיַּית הַמֵּתִים מִן הַתּוֹרָה  שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וּנְתַתֶּם מִמֶּנּוּ [אֶת] תְּרוּמַת ה' לְאַהֲרֹן הַכֹּהֵן וְכִי אַהֲרֹן לְעוֹלָם קַיָּים וַהֲלֹא לֹא נִכְנַס לְאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁנּוֹתְנִין לוֹ תְּרוּמָה אֶלָּא מְלַמֵּד שֶׁעָתִיד לִחְיוֹת וְיִשְׂרָאֵל נוֹתְנִין לוֹ תְּרוּמָה  מִכָּאן לִתְחִיַּית הַמֵּתִים מִן הַתּוֹרָה
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: From where resurrection of the dead from the Torah? as it is stated “And you shall give the teruma of the Lord to Aaron the priest” And does Aaron exist forever But is it not did not enter Eretz Yisrael, where give him teruma ? Rather, teaches that to live in the future and the Jewish people give him teruma . From here the resurrection of the dead is from the Torah.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yochanan: From where do we derive the resurrection of the dead from the Torah? As it is stated, "And you shall give him Aaron the priest the contribution of the Lord" (Numbers 18:28). But is Aaron forever alive? Has he not entered the land of Israel, to which they give him a contribution? Rather, this teaches that he is destined to live again, and Israel will give him a contribution. From here we derive the resurrection of the dead from the Torah.

hebrew_text: דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל תָּנָא 'לְאַהֲרֹן'  כְּאַהֲרֹן מָה אַהֲרֹן חָבֵר  אַף בָּנָיו חֲבֵרִים
human_translation: The school of Rabbi Yishmael taught “to Aaron” like Aaron; just as Aaron is one devoted to the meticulous observance of mitzvot, particularly those relating to ritual purity, teruma , and tithes [ ḥaver ], so too his descendants ḥaverim .
llm_translation: The school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: "Regarding 'to Aharon,' just as Aharon was a friend, so too his sons were friends."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן מִנַּיִין שֶׁאֵין נוֹתְנִין תְּרוּמָה לְכֹהֵן עַם הָאָרֶץ  שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וַיֹּאמֶר לָעָם לְיוֹשְׁבֵי יְרוּשָׁלִַים לָתֵת מְנָת הַכֹּהֲנִים וְהַלְוִיִּם לְמַעַן יֶחֶזְקוּ בְּתוֹרַת ה' כׇּל הַמַּחְזִיק בְּתוֹרַת ה'  יֵשׁ לוֹ מְנָת וְשֶׁאֵינוֹ מַחְזִיק בְּתוֹרַת ה'  אֵין לוֹ מְנָת
human_translation: Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani says Rabbi Yonatan says: From where that one does not give teruma to a priest an am ha’aretz ? as it is stated: “And he commanded the people who dwelled in Jerusalem to give the portion of the priests and of the Levites, so that they may firmly adhere to the Torah of the Lord” Everyone who firmly adheres to the Torah of the Lord has a portion, and anyone who does not firmly adhere to the Torah of the Lord does not have a portion.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said, Rabbi Yonatan said: From where do we derive that one does not give terumah to an am ha'aretz priest? As it is stated, "And he said to the people, to the inhabitants of Jerusalem, to give the portion of the priests and the Levites, so that they might be strong in the Torah of the Lord." Whoever holds onto the Torah of the Lord has a portion, and whoever does not hold onto the Torah of the Lord does not have a portion.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אַחָא בַּר אַדָּא אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה כׇּל הַנּוֹתֵן תְּרוּמָה לְכֹהֵן עַם הָאָרֶץ כְּאִילּוּ נוֹתְנָהּ לִפְנֵי אֲרִי מָה אֲרִי סָפֵק דּוֹרֵס וְאוֹכֵל סָפֵק אֵינוֹ דּוֹרֵס וְאוֹכֵל  אַף כֹּהֵן עַם הָאָרֶץ סָפֵק אוֹכְלָהּ בְּטׇהֳרָה סָפֵק אוֹכְלָהּ בְּטוּמְאָה
human_translation: Rav Aḥa bar Adda says Rav Yehuda says: anyone who gives teruma to a priest an am ha’aretz , it is as though he placed before a lion. Just as a lion, uncertainty maul and eat uncertainty not maul and eat so too, a priest an am ha’aretz uncertainty eat it in purity, uncertainty eat it in impurity,
llm_translation: Rav Ahah bar Adda said in the name of Rav Yehudah: Anyone who gives terumah to an am ha'aretz is as if he gave it before a lion. Just as a lion sometimes tramples and eats, and sometimes does not trample and eat, so too an am ha'aretz sometimes eats it in purity, and sometimes eats it in impurity.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר אַף גּוֹרֵם לוֹ מִיתָה שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וּמֵתוּ בוֹ כִּי יְחַלְּלֻהוּ דְּבֵי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב תָּנָא אַף מַשִּׂיאוֹ עֲוֹן אַשְׁמָה שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וְהִשִּׂיאוּ אוֹתָם עֲוֹן אַשְׁמָה בְּאׇכְלָם אֶת קׇדְשֵׁיהֶם
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: even causes death, as it is stated “And die therefore if they profane it” The school of Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov taught: one also brings upon him a sin of guilt, as it is stated: “And so bring upon them a sin of guilt when they eat their sacred items”
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: Even a mouse causes it (the altar) to become invalid, as it is stated: "And they shall die in it when they defile it" (Leviticus 22:9). The school of Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov taught: Even one who causes guilt to be incurred, as it is stated: "And they shall bear their iniquity, guilt, when they eat their holy things" (Leviticus 22:16).

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא רַבִּי סִימַאי אוֹמֵר מִנַּיִין לִתְחִיַּית הַמֵּתִים מִן הַתּוֹרָה  שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר 'וְגַם הֲקִמֹתִי אֶת בְּרִיתִי אִתָּם לָתֵת לָהֶם אֶת אֶרֶץ כְּנַעַן' 'לָכֶם' לֹא נֶאֱמַר אֶלָּא 'לָהֶם'  מִכָּאן לִתְחִיַּית הַמֵּתִים מִן הַתּוֹרָה
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Simai says: From where resurrection of the dead from the Torah? as it is stated “I have also established My covenant with them to give to them the land of Canaan” to you is not stated, rather, to them From here the resurrection of the dead is from the Torah,
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi Simai says, from where do we derive the resurrection of the dead from the Torah? As it is stated, "And I will establish My covenant with them to give them the land of Canaan" (Exodus 6:4). It does not say "to you" but rather "to them." From here we derive the resurrection of the dead from the Torah.

hebrew_text: (צֶדֶק גַּם גֶּשֶׁם קָם סִימָן) שָׁאֲלוּ צַדּוּקִים אֶת רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל מִנַּיִין שֶׁהַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא מְחַיֶּיה מֵתִים אָמַר לָהֶם מִן הַתּוֹרָה וּמִן הַנְּבִיאִים וּמִן הַכְּתוּבִים וְלֹא קִיבְּלוּ מִמֶּנּוּ
human_translation: Tzadi , dalet , kuf ; gimmel , mem ; gimmel , shin , mem ; kuf , mem .Heretics asked Rabban Gamliel: From where that the Holy One, Blessed be He, revives the dead? said to them from the Torah, from the Prophets, and from Writings, but they did not accept from him.
llm_translation: (Justice, even rain, is a sign) The Sadducees asked Rabban Gamliel, "From where do we know that the Holy One, blessed be He, resurrects the dead?" He said to them, "From the Torah, and from the Prophets, and from the Writings, and they did not accept it from him."

hebrew_text: מִן הַתּוֹרָה  דִּכְתִיב 'וַיֹּאמֶר ה' אֶל מֹשֶׁה הִנְּךָ שֹׁכֵב עִם אֲבֹתֶיךָ וְקָם' אָמְרוּ לוֹ וְדִילְמָא 'וְקָם הָעָם הַזֶּה וְזָנָה'
human_translation: from the Torah as it is written: “And the Lord said to Moses, behold, you shall lie with your fathers and arise” said to him: But perhaps and this people will arise and stray
llm_translation: From the Torah, as it is written, "And Hashem said to Moshe, 'Behold, you are lying with your forefathers, and you will arise.'" They said to him, perhaps it means, "And this nation will arise and commit harlotry."

hebrew_text: מִן הַנְּבִיאִים  דִּכְתִיב 'יִחְיוּ מֵתֶיךָ נְבֵלָתִי יְקוּמוּן הָקִיצוּ וְרַנְּנוּ שֹׁכְנֵי עָפָר כִּי טַל אוֹרֹת טַלֶּךָ וָאָרֶץ רְפָאִים תַּפִּיל' וְדִילְמָא מֵתִים שֶׁהֶחְיָה יְחֶזְקֵאל
human_translation: from the Prophets as it is written: “Your dead shall live, my corpse shall arise. Awake and sing, you that dwell in the dust, for your dew is as the dew of vegetation, and the land shall cast out the dead” But perhaps the dead that Ezekiel revived.
llm_translation: From the Prophets, as it is written: "Your dead shall live; their corpses shall rise. Awake and sing, you who dwell in the dust, for Your dew is like the dew of light, and the earth shall cast forth the shades." And perhaps it refers to the dead that Ezekiel revived.

hebrew_text: מִן הַכְּתוּבִים דִּכְתִיב 'וְחִכֵּךְ כְּיֵין הַטּוֹב הוֹלֵךְ לְדוֹדִי לְמֵישָׁרִים דּוֹבֵב שִׂפְתֵי יְשָׁנִים' וְדִילְמָא רַחוֹשֵׁי מְרַחֲשָׁן שִׂפְווֹתֵיהּ בְּעָלְמָא כְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יְהוֹצָדָק כׇּל מִי שֶׁנֶּאֶמְרָה הֲלָכָה בִּשְׁמוֹ בְּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה שִׂפְתוֹתָיו דּוֹבְבוֹת בַּקֶּבֶר שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר 'דּוֹבֵב שִׂפְתֵי יְשֵׁנִים'
human_translation: from Writings as it is written: “And your palate is like the best wine that glides down smoothly for my beloved, moving gently the lips of those that sleep” But perhaps merely their lips will move, in accordance with Rabbi Yoḥanan, as Rabbi Yoḥanan says in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yehotzadak: Anyone in whose name a halakha is stated in this world, his lips move in the grave as it is stated: “Moving gently the lips of those that sleep.”
llm_translation: From the Writings it is written, "Your lips drip honey, my bride; honey and milk are under your tongue." And perhaps the whispers of his lips in this world are like Rabbi Yochanan who said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yehotzadak: Anyone in whom the Halacha is spoken in his name in this world, his lips murmur in the grave, as it is said, "The lips of the sleeping whisper."

hebrew_text: עַד שֶׁאָמַר לָהֶם מִקְרָא זֶה 'אֲשֶׁר נִשְׁבַּע ה' לַאֲבֹתֵיכֶם לָתֵת לָהֶם' 'לָכֶם' לֹא נֶאֱמַר אֶלָּא 'לָהֶם'  מִיכָּן לִתְחִיַּית הַמֵּתִים מִן הַתּוֹרָה
human_translation: until stated to them this verse: that the Lord took an oath to your forefathers to give them” To you, is not stated; rather, “To them,” From here resurrection of the dead from the Torah.
llm_translation: Until he said to them this verse 'which the Lord swore to your fathers to give to them' 'to you' is not said but 'to them' from here for the resurrection of the dead from the Torah.

hebrew_text: וְיֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים מִן הַמִּקְרָא הַזֶּה אָמַר לָהֶם וְאַתֶּם הַדְּבֵקִים בַּה' אֱלֹהֵיכֶם חַיִּים כֻּלְּכֶם הַיּוֹם פְּשִׁיטָא דְּחַיִּים כֻּלְּכֶם הַיּוֹם אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ בְּיוֹם שֶׁכׇּל הָעוֹלָם כּוּלָּם מֵתִים אַתֶּם חַיִּים מָה הַיּוֹם כּוּלְּכֶם קַיָּימִין  אַף לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא כּוּלְּכֶם קַיָּימִין
human_translation: And there are those who say from this verse he said to them “But you who cleave to the Lord your God every one of you is alive this day” obvious “every one of you is alive this day”? Rather, Even on the day when everyone is dead you will live; just as today every one of you is alive, so too, in the World-to-Come every one of you alive.
llm_translation: And some say from this verse it said to them, "But you who cling to the Lord your God are all alive today." It is obvious that you are all alive today, but even on a day when the whole world is dead, you are alive. Just as today you are all alive, so too in the World to Come you are all alive.

hebrew_text: שָׁאֲלוּ רוֹמִיִּים אֶת רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן חֲנַנְיָה מִנַּיִין שֶׁהַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא מְחַיֵּה מֵתִים וְיוֹדֵעַ מַה שֶּׁעָתִיד לִהְיוֹת אֲמַר לְהוּ תַּרְוַויְיהוּ מִן הַמִּקְרָא הַזֶּה שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר 'וַיֹּאמֶר ה' אֶל מֹשֶׁה הִנְּךָ שֹׁכֵב עִם אֲבֹתֶיךָ וְקָם הָעָם הַזֶּה וְזָנָה'
human_translation: The Romans asked Rabbi Yehoshua ben Ḥananya: From where that the Holy One, Blessed be He, revives the dead, and He knows what is destined to be? said to them: Both of those from this verse, as it is stated: “And the Lord said to Moses, Behold, you shall lie with your fathers and arise; this people will go astray”
llm_translation: The Romans asked Rabbi Yehoshua ben Chananiah: From where do we know that the Holy One, blessed be He, revives the dead and knows what will be in the future? He said to them: Learn it from this verse, as it is stated, "And the Lord said to Moses: Behold, you are about to lie with your fathers, and this people will rise up and stray."

hebrew_text: וְדִילְמָא 'וְקָם הָעָם הַזֶּה וְזָנָה' אֲמַר לְהוּ נְקוּטוּ מִיהָא פַּלְגָא בִּידַיְיכוּ דְּיוֹדֵעַ מַה שֶּׁעָתִיד לִהְיוֹת אִיתְּמַר נָמֵי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַאי מִנַּיִין שֶׁהַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא מְחַיֵּה מֵתִים וְיוֹדֵעַ מַה שֶּׁעָתִיד לִהְיוֹת  שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר הִנְּךָ שֹׁכֵב עִם אֲבֹתֶיךָ וְקָם וְגוֹ'
human_translation: But perhaps and this people will arise and go astray said to them: Take at least half in your hands that knows what is destined to be. It was also stated Rabbi Yoḥanan says in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai: From where that the Holy One, Blessed be He, revives the dead, and He knows what is destined to be? as it is stated: “Behold, you shall lie with your fathers and arise.”
llm_translation: Perhaps 'and this people will rise and go astray' he said to them, let us take from her half in your hands that you know what will happen. It was said, indeed, Rabbi Yochanan said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai: From where do we know that the Holy One, blessed be He, revives the dead and knows what will happen? As it is stated, 'You are lying with your fathers, and you will rise...'

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא אָמַר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּדָבָר זֶה זִיַּיפְתִּי סִפְרֵי כוּתִים שֶׁהָיוּ אוֹמְרִים אֵין תְּחִיַּית הַמֵּתִים מִן הַתּוֹרָה אָמַרְתִּי לָהֶן זִיַּיפְתֶּם תּוֹרַתְכֶם וְלֹא הֶעֱלִיתֶם בְּיֶדְכֶם כְּלוּם שֶׁאַתֶּם אוֹמְרִים אֵין תְּחִיַּית הַמֵּתִים מִן הַתּוֹרָה הֲרֵי הוּא אוֹמֵר 'הִכָּרֵת תִּכָּרֵת הַנֶּפֶשׁ הַהִיא עֲוֹנָהּ בָּהּ' 'הִכָּרֵת תִּכָּרֵת' בָּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה 'עֲוֹנָהּ בָּהּ'  לְאֵימַת לָאו לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Eliezer, son of Rabbi Yosei, says: With this matter, I refuted the books of the Samaritans, as they would say there is no the resurrection of the dead from the Torah. I said to them: You falsified your torah and you accomplished nothing, as you say there is no the resurrection of the dead from the Torah, states: “That soul shall be excised; his iniquity shall be upon him” shall be excised” in this world. “his iniquity shall be upon him,” for when not for the World-to-Come,
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Eliezer, son of Rabbi Yosei, said regarding this matter, "I have refuted the books of the Samaritans who used to say, 'There is no resurrection of the dead in the Torah.' I said to them, 'You have refuted your own Torah, and you have not brought it in your hands as if you are saying, "There is no resurrection of the dead in the Torah." Behold, it says, 'Cut off shall be that soul from its people; its sin it bears.' 'Cut off shall be' - in this world. 'Its sin it bears' - to what is this referring? Not to this world, but to the world to come."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב פָּפָּא לְאַבָּיֵי וְלֵימָא לְהוּ תַּרְוַיְיהוּ מֵהִכָּרֵת תִּכָּרֵת  אִינְהוּ הֲווֹ אָמְרִי לֵיהּ דִּבְּרָה תּוֹרָה כִּלְשׁוֹן בְּנֵי אָדָם
human_translation: Rav Pappa said to Abaye: And let say to both of those from “shall be excised [ hikkaret tikkaret ].” would say: The Torah spoke in the language of people,
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Papa to Abbaye, and say to them both: "From the cutting, it shall be cut off." They said to him: The Torah spoke in the language of man.

hebrew_text: כְּתַנָּאֵי 'הִכָּרֵת תִּכָּרֵת' 'הִכָּרֵת' בָּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה 'תִּכָּרֵת' לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל וַהֲלֹא כְּבָר נֶאֱמַר 'אֶת ה' הוּא מְגַדֵּף וְנִכְרְתָה' וְכִי שְׁלֹשָׁה עוֹלָמִים יֵשׁ אֶלָּא 'וְנִכְרְתָה' בָּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה 'הִכָּרֵת' לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא 'הִכָּרֵת תִּכָּרֵת' דִּבְּרָה תוֹרָה כִלְשׁוֹן בְּנֵי אָדָם
human_translation: parallel tanna’im “ hikkaret tikkaret ,” “ Hikkaret ” in this world, “ tikkaret ” in the World-to-Come; the statement of Rabbi Akiva. Rabbi Yishmael said to him: Isn’t it already stated “That person that blasphemes the Lord, that soul shall be excised [ venikhreta ]” and are there three worlds Rather, “ venikhreta ” in this world, “ hikkaret ” in the World-to-Come, “ hikkaret tikkaret ” the Torah spoke in the language of people.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: As the Tannaim taught: "He shall surely be cut off" - in this world; "He shall surely be cut off" - in the world to come. These are the words of Rabbi Akiva. Rabbi Yishmael said to him: But has it not already been stated, "That soul shall be utterly cut off; he has blasphemed the Lord" (Numbers 15:30)? Is there not only "he shall surely be cut off" in this world, and "he shall surely be cut off" in the world to come? The Torah spoke in the language of people, "He shall surely be cut off, he shall surely be cut off."

hebrew_text: בֵּין רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל וּבֵין רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא עֲוֹנָהּ בָּהּ מַאי עָבְדִי בֵּיהּ לְכִדְתַנְיָא יָכוֹל אֲפִילּוּ עָשָׂה תְּשׁוּבָה  תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר 'עֲוֹנָהּ בָּהּ'  לֹא אָמַרְתִּי אֶלָּא בִּזְמַן שֶׁעֲוֹנָהּ בָּהּ
human_translation: both Rabbi Yishmael and Rabbi Akiva, what do they do with, “His iniquity shall be upon him”? for that which is taught might even he repented. the verse states: “His iniquity shall be upon him.” I said only when his iniquity upon him.
llm_translation: Between Rabbi Yishmael and Rabbi Akiva, what is the liability of a woman who commits adultery? What does one do with her? As it was taught: One might think that even if she repents, the Torah teaches 'her guilt is upon her.' I only said this when her guilt is upon her.

hebrew_text: שָׁאֲלָה קְלֵיאוֹפַּטְרָא מַלְכְּתָא אֶת רַבִּי מֵאִיר אָמְרָה יָדַעְנָא דְּחָיִי שָׁכְבֵי דִּכְתִיב 'וְיָצִיצוּ מֵעִיר כְּעֵשֶׂב הָאָרֶץ' אֶלָּא כְּשֶׁהֵן עוֹמְדִין עוֹמְדִין עֲרוּמִין אוֹ בִּלְבוּשֵׁיהֶן עוֹמְדִין אֲמַר לַהּ קַל וָחוֹמֶר מֵחִיטָּה וּמָה חִיטָּה שֶׁנִּקְבְּרָה עֲרוּמָּה יוֹצְאָה בְּכַמָּה לְבוּשִׁין צַדִּיקִים שֶׁנִּקְבָּרִים בִּלְבוּשֵׁיהֶן עַל אַחַת כַּמָּה וְכַמָּה
human_translation: Queen Cleopatra asked Rabbi Meir She said: I know that the dead will live, as it is written: “And may they blossom out of the city like grass of the earth” But when they arise, arise naked or they arise with their garments? said to her: a fortiori from wheat. If wheat, which is buried naked, emerges with several garments all the more so the righteous, who are buried with their garments,
llm_translation: The queen asked Rabbi Meir: "I know that the dead will rise, as it is written, 'And they shall spring up out of the city like grass of the earth.' But will they rise naked or in their garments?" He said to her: "A fortiori from wheat. Just as wheat, which is buried naked, sprouts forth with how many coverings do the righteous, who are buried in their garments, rise?"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ קֵיסָר לְרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אָמְרִיתוּ דְּשָׁכְבֵי חָיִי הָא הָווּ עַפְרָא וְעַפְרָא מִי קָא חָיֵי
human_translation: emperor said to Rabban Gamliel: You say that the dead will live. Aren’t they dust? And does dust come to life?
llm_translation: He said to him, Caesar to Rabban Gamliel, "You have said that the living should lie down. If so, who is living?"

hebrew_text: אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ בְּרַתֵּיה שִׁבְקֵיהּ וַאֲנָא מַהְדַּרְנָא לֵיהּ שְׁנֵי יוֹצְרִים יֵשׁ בְּעִירֵנוּ אֶחָד יוֹצֵר מִן הַמַּיִם וְאֶחָד יוֹצֵר מִן הַטִּיט אֵיזֶה מֵהֶן מְשׁוּבָּח אָמַר לָהּ זֶה שֶׁיּוֹצֵר מִן הַמַּיִם אָמְרָה לוֹ מִן הַמַּיִם צָר מִן הַטִּיט לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן
human_translation: The daughter of said Leave him, and I will respond to him There are two craftsmen in our city; one fashions from water, and one fashions from mortar. Which is more noteworthy? said to her: that that fashions from water. said to him: he fashions from the water, all the more so not from mortar?
llm_translation: She said to him: "Let your daughter leave him, and I will provide for him two craftsmen in our city, one crafts from water and one crafts from clay. Which of them is praiseworthy?" He said to her: "The one who crafts from water." She said to him: "From water, is it not necessary from clay even more so."

hebrew_text: דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל תָּנָא קַל וָחוֹמֶר מִכְּלֵי זְכוּכִית מָה כְּלֵי זְכוּכִית שֶׁעֲמָלָן בְּרוּחַ בָּשָׂר וָדָם נִשְׁבְּרוּ יֵשׁ לָהֶן תַּקָּנָה בָּשָׂר וָדָם שֶׁבְּרוּחוֹ שֶׁל הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא  עַל אַחַת כַּמָּה וְכַמָּה
human_translation: The school of Rabbi Yishmael taught a fortiori from glass vessels: If glass vessels, which are fashioned by the breath of flesh and blood, they break they can be repaired, flesh and blood, whose the breath of the Holy One, Blessed be He, all the more so
llm_translation: In the school of Rabbi Ishmael, it was taught: A fortiori from vessels of glass. Just as vessels of glass, which are made by the breath of flesh and blood, if they break, they can be repaired, how much more so the flesh and blood that were formed by the breath of the Holy One, blessed be He - how much more so!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ הָהוּא מִינָא לְרַבִּי אַמֵּי אָמְרִיתוּ דְּשָׁכְבֵי חָיִי וְהָא הָווּ עַפְרָא וְעַפְרָא מִי קָא חָיֵי אֲמַר לֵיהּ אֶמְשׁוֹל לְךָ מָשָׁל לְמָה הַדָּבָר דּוֹמֶה  לְמֶלֶךְ בָּשָׂר וָדָם שֶׁאָמַר לַעֲבָדָיו 'לְכוּ וּבְנוּ לִי פַּלְטֵרִין גְּדוֹלִים בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁאֵין מַיִם וְעָפָר' הָלְכוּ וּבָנוּ אוֹתָן לְיָמִים נָפְלוּ אָמַר לָהֶם 'חִזְרוּ וּבְנוּ אוֹתָן בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁיֵּשׁ עָפָר וָמַיִם' אָמְרוּ לוֹ 'אֵין אָנוּ יְכוֹלִין'
human_translation: a certain heretic said to Rabbi Ami: You say that the dead will live. Aren’t they dust? And does dust come to life? said to him: I will tell you a parable. To what is this matter comparable? to a flesh-and-blood king who said to his servants: Go and construct for me a great palace [ palterin ] in a place where there is no water and earth They went and constructed it. Sometime collapsed. said to them: Return and construct in a place where there is earth and water They said to him: We are unable
llm_translation: He said to him that heretic to Rabbi Ammi, "You said that the living lie down, but these were dust, and dust, who will make them live?" He said to him, "I will give you a parable. To what is this matter similar? To a king of flesh and blood who said to his servants, 'Go and build for me large palaces in a place where there is no water and only dust.' They went and built them. After some time, they fell. He said to them, 'Go and build them in a place where there is dust and water.' They said to him, 'We cannot.'"

hebrew_text: כָּעַס עֲלֵיהֶם וְאָמַר לָהֶן בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁאֵין מַיִם וְעָפָר  בְּנִיתֶם עַכְשָׁיו שֶׁיֵּשׁ מַיִם וְעָפָר  עַל אַחַת כַּמָּה וְכַמָּה' וְאִם אִי אַתָּה מַאֲמִין צֵא לַבִּקְעָה וּרְאֵה עַכְבָּר שֶׁהַיּוֹם חֶצְיוֹ בָּשָׂר וְחֶצְיוֹ אֲדָמָה לְמָחָר הִשְׁרִיץ וְנַעֲשָׂה כֻּלּוֹ בָּשָׂר שֶׁמָּא תֹּאמַר לִזְמַן מְרוּבֶּה עֲלֵה לָהָר וּרְאֵה שֶׁהַיּוֹם אֵין בּוֹ אֶלָּא חִלָּזוֹן אֶחָד לְמָחָר יָרְדוּ גְּשָׁמִים וְנִתְמַלֵּא כּוּלּוֹ חֶלְזוֹנוֹת
human_translation: became angry at them and said to them: in a place where there is no water and earth you constructed now that there is water and earth all the more so And if you do not believe go out to the valley and see an akhbar , that today is half flesh and half earth, tomorrow develop and all of it will become flesh. Lest you say over an extended period, ascend a mountain and see that today there is only one snail there; tomorrow, rain have fallen, and it entirely filled with snails.
llm_translation: He became angry with them and said to them, "In a place where there is no water and dust, you have built now that there is water and dust, how much more so! And if you do not believe, go out to the valley and see a mouse that today is half flesh and half earth, tomorrow it will breed and become all flesh. Lest you say it is a coincidence, go up to the mountain and see that today there is only one cloud, tomorrow the rains will come and it will be filled with clouds."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ הָהוּא מִינָא לִגְבִיהָא בֶּן פְּסִיסָא וַוי לְכוֹן חַיָּיבַיָּא דְּאָמְרִיתוּן מִיתֵי חָיִין דְּחָיִין מָיְתִי דְּמִיתֵי חָיִין אֲמַר לֵיהּ וַוי לְכוֹן חַיָּיבַיָּא דְּאָמְרִיתוּן מִיתֵי לָא חָיִין דְּלָא הֲווֹ  חָיִי דַּהֲווֹ חַיֵּי לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן אֲמַר לֵיהּ חַיָּיבַיָּא קָרֵית לִי אִי קָאֵימְנָא בָּעֵיטְנָא בָּךְ וּפָשֵׁיטְנָא לְעַקְמוּתָךְ מִינָּךְ אֲמַר לֵיהּ אִם אַתָּה עוֹשֶׂה כֵּן רוֹפֵא אוּמָּן תִּקָּרֵא וְשָׂכָר הַרְבֵּה תִּטּוֹל
human_translation: a certain heretic said to Geviha ben Pesisa: Woe unto you, the wicked, as you say: The dead will come to life. those alive die. that the dead will come to life? said to him: Woe unto you, the wicked, as you say: The dead will not come to life. those who were not come to life, is it not all the more so those who were alive said to You called me wicked? If I stand, I will kick you and flatten your hump, said to him If you do so, you will be called an expert doctor and will take high wages
llm_translation: He said to him: That heretic, son of a heretic, woe to you, wicked ones, for you say that the living will die and the dead will live. He said to him: Woe to you, wicked ones, for you say that the living will not live, for they were not alive to begin with. He said to him: Wicked ones, you call me a reader, if I am standing, I will tear you apart and uproot you from your place. He said to him: If you do so, you will be called a healer and a skilled craftsman, and you will receive great reward.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן בְּעֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבָּעָה בְּנִיסָן אִיתְנְטִילוּ דֵּימוֹסְנָאֵי מִיהוּדָה וּמִירוּשָׁלַיִם כְּשֶׁבָּאוּ בְּנֵי אַפְרִיקִיָּא לָדוּן עִם יִשְׂרָאֵל לִפְנֵי אֲלֶכְּסַנְדְּרוֹס מוֹקְדוֹן אָמְרוּ לוֹ אֶרֶץ כְּנַעַן שֶׁלָּנוּ הִיא דִּכְתִיב 'אֶרֶץ כְּנַעַן לִגְבֻלֹתֶיהָ' וּכְנַעַן אֲבוּהוֹן דְּהָנְהוּ אִינָשֵׁי הֲוָה
human_translation: The Sages taught On the twenty-fourth in Nisan usurpers [ dimusana’ei ] were expelled from Judea and Jerusalem. When the people of Afrikiya came to judgment with the Jewish people before Alexander of Macedon, they said to him: The land of Canaan is ours, as it is written: the land of Canaan according to its borders” And Canaan is the forefather of these people.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: On the twenty-fourth of Nisan, the Demosnai from Judea and Jerusalem would be appointed, when the sons of Africa came to litigate with the people of Israel before Alkisandros Mokedon. They said to him, "The land of Canaan is ours, as it is written, 'The land of Canaan with its borders,' and Canaan was the father of these people."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לְהוּ גְּבִיהָא בֶּן פְּסִיסָא לַחֲכָמִים תְּנוּ לִי רְשׁוּת וְאֵלֵךְ וְאָדוּן עִמָּהֶן לִפְנֵי אֲלֶכְּסַנְדְּרוֹס מוֹקְדוֹן אִם יְנַצְּחוּנִי אִמְרוּ 'הֶדְיוֹט שֶׁבָּנוּ נִצַּחְתֶּם' וְאִם אֲנִי אֲנַצֵּחַ אוֹתָם אִמְרוּ לָהֶם 'תּוֹרַת מֹשֶׁה נִצְּחַתְכֶם' נָתְנוּ לוֹ רְשׁוּת וְהָלַךְ וְדָן עִמָּהֶם
human_translation: Geviha ben Pesisa said to the Sages: Give me permission and I will go and deliberate with them before Alexander of Macedon. If they will defeat me, say You have defeated an ordinary from among us, And if I will defeat them, say to them: The Torah of Moses defeated you, gave him permission, and he went and deliberated with them.
llm_translation: He said to them, the son of Pesisah, to the sages, "Give me permission and I will go and argue before Alexander Mokdon, if they defeat me, say 'the laymen among you have defeated me,' but if I defeat them, say to them 'the Torah of Moses has defeated you.' They gave him permission and he went and argued with them.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָהֶם מֵהֵיכָן אַתֶּם מְבִיאִים רְאָיָיה אָמְרוּ לוֹ מִן הַתּוֹרָה אָמַר לָהֶן אַף אֲנִי לֹא אָבִיא לָכֶם רְאָיָיה אֶלָּא מִן הַתּוֹרָה שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר 'וַיֹּאמֶר אָרוּר כְּנָעַן עֶבֶד עֲבָדִים יִהְיֶה לְאֶחָיו' עֶבֶד שֶׁקָּנָה נְכָסִים  עֶבֶד לְמִי וּנְכָסִים לְמִי וְלֹא עוֹד אֶלָּא שֶׁהֲרֵי כַּמָּה שָׁנִים שֶׁלֹּא עֲבַדְתּוּנוּ
human_translation: said to them: From where are you citing proof They said to him: From the Torah. said to them: I too will cite proof to you only from the Torah, as it is stated: “And he said: Cursed will be Canaan; a slave of slaves shall he be to his brethren” a slave who acquired property, slave to whom property to whom? And moreover, several years that you have not served us.
llm_translation: He said to them, "From where do you bring proof?" They said to him, "From the Torah." He said to them, "I also will not bring you proof except from the Torah, as it is stated, 'Cursed be Canaan; a servant of servants shall he be to his brothers.' A servant who acquires possessions—whose servant is he, and whose possessions are they? And furthermore, for how many years have you not served us?"

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָהֶם אֲלֶכְּסַנְדְּרוֹס מַלְכָּא הַחְזִירוּ לוֹ תְּשׁוּבָה אָמְרוּ לוֹ תְּנוּ לָנוּ זְמַן שְׁלֹשָׁה יָמִים נָתַן לָהֶם זְמַן בָּדְקוּ וְלֹא מָצְאוּ תְּשׁוּבָה מִיָּד בָּרְחוּ וְהִנִּיחוּ שְׂדוֹתֵיהֶן כְּשֶׁהֵן זְרוּעוֹת וְכַרְמֵיהֶן כְּשֶׁהֵן נְטוּעוֹת וְאוֹתָהּ שָׁנָה שְׁבִיעִית הָיְתָה
human_translation: Alexander the king said to Provide a response They said to Give us time; three days gave them time they examined and did not find a response Immediately, they fled and abandoned their fields when they sown and their vineyards when they planted. And that year was a Sabbatical
llm_translation: He said to them, "Alkisandros the king, bring him back to repentance." They said to him, "Give us a period of three days." He gave them a period. They searched and did not find repentance. Immediately they fled and left their fields as they were sown and their vineyards as they were planted. And that year was a Sabbatical year.

hebrew_text: שׁוּב פַּעַם אַחַת בָּאוּ בְּנֵי מִצְרַיִם לָדוּן עִם יִשְׂרָאֵל לִפְנֵי אֲלֶכְּסַנְדְּרוֹס מוֹקְדוֹן אָמְרוּ לוֹ הֲרֵי הוּא אוֹמֵר 'וַה' נָתַן אֶת חֵן הָעָם בְּעֵינֵי מִצְרַיִם וַיַּשְׁאִלוּם'  תְּנוּ לָנוּ כֶּסֶף וְזָהָב שֶׁנְּטַלְתֶּם מִמֶּנּוּ
human_translation: another occasion, the people of Egypt came to judgment with the Jewish people before Alexander of Macedon. said to It says “And the Lord gave the people favor in the eyes of Egypt, and they lent them” Give us the silver and gold that you took from us;
llm_translation: Return once the sons of Egypt came to litigate with Israel before Alexander Mokdon. They said to him, "Behold, he says, 'And Hashem gave the people favor in the eyes of Egypt, and they lent them.' Give us back the silver and gold that you took from us."

hebrew_text: אָמַר גְּבִיהָא בֶּן פְּסִיסָא לַחֲכָמִים תְּנוּ לִי רְשׁוּת וְאֵלֵךְ וְאָדוּן עִמָּהֶן לִפְנֵי אֲלֶכְּסַנְדְּרוֹס אִם יְנַצְּחוּנִי אִמְרוּ לָהֶם 'הֶדְיוֹט שֶׁבָּנוּ נִצַּחְתֶּם' וְאִם אֲנִי אֲנַצֵּחַ אוֹתָם אִמְרוּ לָהֶם 'תּוֹרַת מֹשֶׁה רַבֵּינוּ נִצְּחַתְכֶם' נָתְנוּ לוֹ רְשׁוּת וְהָלַךְ וְדָן עִמָּהֶן
human_translation: Geviha ben Pesisa said to the Sages: Give me permission and I will go and deliberate with them before Alexander If they will defeat me, say You have defeated an ordinary from among us, And if I will defeat them, say to them: The Torah of Moses, our teacher, defeated you, gave him permission, and he went and deliberated with them.
llm_translation: The son of Pesisah said to the sages, "Give me permission, and I will go and argue before Alexander of Macedon. If they defeat me, say to them, 'You have defeated a layman.' But if I defeat them, say to them, 'You have been defeated by the Torah of our teacher Moses.'" They gave him permission, and he went and argued with them.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָהֶן מֵהֵיכָן אַתֶּם מְבִיאִין רְאָיָיה אָמְרוּ לוֹ מִן הַתּוֹרָה אָמַר לָהֶן אַף אֲנִי לֹא אָבִיא לָכֶם רְאָיָיה אֶלָּא מִן הַתּוֹרָה שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר 'וּמוֹשַׁב בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל אֲשֶׁר יָשְׁבוּ בְּמִצְרָיִם שְׁלֹשִׁים שָׁנָה וְאַרְבַּע מֵאוֹת שָׁנָה' תְּנוּ לָנוּ שְׂכַר עֲבוֹדָה שֶׁל שִׁשִּׁים רִיבּוֹא שֶׁשִּׁיעְבַּדְתֶּם בְּמִצְרַיִם שְׁלֹשִׁים שָׁנָה וְאַרְבַּע מֵאוֹת שָׁנָה
human_translation: said to them: From where are you citing proof They said to him: From the Torah. said to them: I too will cite proof to you only from the Torah, as it is stated: “And the sojourning of the children of Israel, who dwelt in Egypt, was four hundred and thirty years” Give us the wages for the work by 600,000 whom you enslaved in Egypt four hundred and thirty years.
llm_translation: He said to them, "From where do you bring proof?" They said to him, "From the Torah." He said to them, "I also will not bring you proof except from the Torah, as it is stated, 'And the dwelling of the children of Israel, who dwelled in Egypt, was thirty years and four hundred years.' Give us the reward for the labor of sixty myriads that you worked in Egypt, thirty years and four hundred years."

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָהֶן אֲלֶכְּסַנְדְּרוֹס מוֹקְדוֹן הַחְזִירוּ לוֹ תְּשׁוּבָה אָמְרוּ לוֹ תְּנוּ לָנוּ זְמַן שְׁלֹשָׁה יָמִים נָתַן לָהֶם זְמַן בָּדְקוּ וְלֹא מָצְאוּ תְּשׁוּבָה מִיָּד הִנִּיחוּ שְׂדוֹתֵיהֶן כְּשֶׁהֵן זְרוּעוֹת וְכַרְמֵיהֶן כְּשֶׁהֵן נְטוּעוֹת וּבָרְחוּ וְאוֹתָהּ שָׁנָה שְׁבִיעִית הָיְתָה
human_translation: Alexander of Macedon said to Provide a response They said to him: Give us time; three days gave them time they examined and did not find a response Immediately, they abandoned their fields when they sown and their vineyards when they planted, and fled. And that year was a Sabbatical
llm_translation: He said to them, "Alexander Modinon, return to him repentance." They said to him, "Give us a period of three days." He gave them a period. They searched and did not find repentance. Immediately they left their fields as they were sown and their vineyards as they were planted, and they fled. And that year was the seventh year.

hebrew_text: וְשׁוּב פַּעַם אַחַת בָּאוּ בְּנֵי יִשְׁמָעֵאל וּבְנֵי קְטוּרָה לָדוּן עִם יִשְׂרָאֵל לִפְנֵי אֲלֶכְּסַנְדְּרוֹס מוֹקְדוֹן אָמְרוּ לוֹ אֶרֶץ כְּנַעַן שֶׁלָּנוּ וְשֶׁלָּכֶם דִּכְתִיב 'וְאֵלֶּה תֹּלְדֹת יִשְׁמָעֵאל בֶּן אַבְרָהָם' וּכְתִיב 'אֵלֶּה תּוֹלְדֹת יִצְחָק בֶּן אַבְרָהָם'
human_translation: And another occasion, the descendants of Ishmael and the descendants of Keturah came to judgment with the Jewish people before Alexander of Macedon. They said to The land of Canaan is ours and yours, as it is written: “And these are the generations of Ishmael, son of Abraham, and it is written: “And these are the generations of Isaac, son of Abraham”
llm_translation: And again, once the sons of Yishmael and the sons of Keturah came to litigate with the children of Israel before Alkisandros Mokedon. They said to him, "The land of Canaan belongs to us and to you, as it is written, 'And these are the generations of Yishmael, son of Abraham,' and it is also written, 'These are the generations of Yitzchak, son of Abraham.'"

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָהֶן גְּבִיהָא בֶּן פְּסִיסָא לַחֲכָמִים תְּנוּ לִי רְשׁוּת וְאֵלֵךְ וְאָדוּן עִמָּהֶם לִפְנֵי אֲלֶכְּסַנְדְּרוֹס מוֹקְדוֹן אִם יְנַצְּחוּנִי אִמְרוּ 'הֶדְיוֹט שֶׁבָּנוּ נִצַּחְתֶּם' וְאִם אֲנִי אֲנַצֵּחַ אוֹתָם אִמְרוּ לָהֶם 'תּוֹרַת מֹשֶׁה רַבֵּינוּ נִצְּחַתְכֶם' נָתְנוּ לוֹ רְשׁוּת הָלַךְ וְדָן עִמָּהֶן
human_translation: Geviha ben Pesisa said to the Sages: Give me permission and I will go and deliberate with them before Alexander of Macedon. If they will defeat me, say You have defeated an ordinary from among us, And if I will defeat them, say to them: The Torah of Moses, our teacher, defeated you, gave him permission, and he went and deliberated with them.
llm_translation: He said to them, Geviha son of Pesisa, to the sages, "Give me permission, and I will go and debate with them before Alexandros Mokdon, if they defeat me, say, 'The laymen among us have defeated you,' but if I defeat them, say to them, 'The Torah of our teacher Moses has defeated you.' They gave him permission, he went and debated with them."

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָהֶם מֵהֵיכָן אַתֶּם מְבִיאִין רְאָיָיה אָמְרוּ לוֹ מִן הַתּוֹרָה אָמַר לָהֶן אַף אֲנִי לֹא אָבִיא רְאָיָיה אֶלָּא מִן הַתּוֹרָה שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר 'וַיִּתֵּן אַבְרָהָם אֶת כׇּל אֲשֶׁר לוֹ לְיִצְחָק וְלִבְנֵי הַפִּילַגְשִׁים אֲשֶׁר לְאַבְרָהָם נָתַן אַבְרָהָם מַתָּנֹת' אָב שֶׁנָּתַן אֲגִטִּין לְבָנָיו בְּחַיָּיו וְשִׁיגֵּר זֶה מֵעַל זֶה כְּלוּם יֵשׁ לָזֶה עַל זֶה כְּלוּם מַאי מַתָּנוֹת אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה בַּר אַבָּא מְלַמֵּד שֶׁמָּסַר לָהֶם שֵׁם טוּמְאָה
human_translation: said to From where are you citing proof They said to him: From the Torah. said to them: I too will cite proof to you only from the Torah, as it is stated: “And Abraham gave all that he had to Isaac. But to the sons of the concubines that Abraham had, Abraham gave gifts, a father who gave a document of bequest [ agatin ] to his sons during his lifetime and sent one away from the other, does have any claim against the other? What gifts Rabbi Yirmeya bar Abba says: teaches that provided them name impurity,
llm_translation: He said to them, "From where do you bring proof?" They said to him, "From the Torah." He said to them, "I also will not bring proof except from the Torah, as it is stated, 'And Abraham gave all that he had to Isaac. But to the sons of Abraham's concubines, Abraham gave gifts while he was still living, and he sent them away from his son Isaac eastward, to the land of the East' (Genesis 25:5-6). A father who gave gifts to his sons during his lifetime, and one who sent one away from the other, it is as if he gave nothing to this one and nothing to that one. What are the gifts?" Rabbi Yirmiyah bar Abba said: This teaches that he imparted to them the status of impurity.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַנְטוֹנִינוּס לְרַבִּי גּוּף וּנְשָׁמָה יְכוֹלִין לִפְטוֹר עַצְמָן מִן הַדִּין כֵּיצַד  גּוּף אוֹמֵר 'נְשָׁמָה חָטָאת  שֶׁמִּיּוֹם שֶׁפֵּירְשָׁה מִמֶּנִּי הֲרֵינִי מוּטָּל כְּאֶבֶן דּוּמָם בַּקֶּבֶר' וּנְשָׁמָה אוֹמֶרֶת 'גּוּף חָטָא שֶׁמִּיּוֹם שֶׁפֵּירַשְׁתִּי מִמֶּנּוּ הֲרֵינִי פּוֹרַחַת בָּאֲוִיר כְּצִפּוֹר' אֲמַר לֵיהּ אֶמְשׁוֹל לְךָ מָשָׁל לְמָה הַדָּבָר דּוֹמֶה  לְמֶלֶךְ בָּשָׂר וָדָם שֶׁהָיָה לוֹ פַּרְדֵּס נָאֶה וְהָיָה בּוֹ
human_translation: Antoninos, said to Rabbi The body and the soul are able to exempt themselves from judgment How so? The body says: The soul sinned, as from the day when it departed from me, I am cast like a silent stone in the grave, And the soul says: The body sinned, as from the day that I departed from it, I am flying in the air like a bird, said to him: I will tell you a parable. To what is this matter comparable? to a king of flesh and blood who had a fine orchard, and in it there were
llm_translation: He said to him, Antoninus said to Rabbi, "Body and soul can exempt themselves from judgment. How so? The body says, 'The soul has sinned, from the day she separated from me, behold I am lying like a silent stone in the grave.' And the soul says, 'The body has sinned, from the day I separated from him, behold I soar in the air like a bird.' He said to him, "I will give you a parable. To what is this matter comparable? To a king of flesh and blood who had a beautiful orchard, and in it..."

hebrew_text: בַּכּוּרוֹת נָאוֹת וְהוֹשִׁיב בּוֹ שְׁנֵי שׁוֹמְרִים אֶחָד חִיגֵּר וְאֶחָד סוֹמֵא אָמַר לוֹ חִיגֵּר לַסּוֹמֵא 'בַּכּוּרוֹת נָאוֹת אֲנִי רוֹאֶה בַּפַּרְדֵּס בֹּא וְהַרְכִּיבֵנִי וּנְבִיאֵם לְאׇכְלָם' רָכַב חִיגֵּר עַל גַּבֵּי סוֹמֵא וֶהֱבִיאוּם וַאֲכָלוּם
human_translation: fine first fruits and he stationed two guards in one lame, and one blind. The lame said to the blind I see fine first fruits in the orchard; come and place me and we will bring to eat them. The lame rode upon the blind and they brought and ate them.
llm_translation: First Fruits are beautiful, and he placed over them two guards, one blind and one lame. The blind guard said to the lame guard, "First Fruits are beautiful, I see them in the orchard, come and carry me and we will bring them to eat." The blind guard rode on the back of the lame guard, and they brought them and ate them.

hebrew_text: לְיָמִים בָּא בַּעַל פַּרְדֵּס אָמַר לָהֶן 'בַּכּוּרוֹת נָאוֹת הֵיכָן הֵן' אָמַר לוֹ חִיגֵּר 'כְּלוּם יֵשׁ לִי רַגְלַיִם לְהַלֵּךְ בָּהֶן' אָמַר לוֹ סוֹמֵא 'כְּלוּם יֵשׁ לִי עֵינַיִם לִרְאוֹת' מָה עָשָׂה הִרְכִּיב חִיגֵּר עַל גַּבֵּי סוֹמֵא וְדָן אוֹתָם כְּאֶחָד
human_translation: Sometime the owner of the orchard came He said to The fine first fruits where are they? The lame said: Do I have any legs with which to walk The blind said: Do I have any eyes to see What did do? He placed the lame upon the blind and he judged them as one.
llm_translation: For days, the owner of the orchard came and said to them, "Where are the beautiful first fruits?" Higer said to him, "I have no legs to walk with them." Soma said to him, "I have no eyes to see with them." What did Higer do? He placed Soma on his shoulders and judged them together.

hebrew_text: אַף הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא מֵבִיא נְשָׁמָה וְזוֹרְקָהּ בַּגּוּף וְדָן אוֹתָם כְּאֶחָד שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר 'יִקְרָא אֶל הַשָּׁמַיִם מֵעָל וְאֶל הָאָרֶץ לָדִין עַמּוֹ' 'יִקְרָא אֶל הַשָּׁמַיִם מֵעָל'  זוֹ נְשָׁמָה 'וְאֶל הָאָרֶץ לָדִין עַמּוֹ'  זֶה הַגּוּף
human_translation: So too, the Holy One, Blessed be He, brings the soul and casts it into the body, and He judges them as one, as it is stated: “He calls to the heavens above and to the earth that He may judge His people” “He calls to the heavens above”; this is the soul, “And to the earth that He may judge His people”; this is the body,
llm_translation: The Holy One, blessed be He, brings the soul and places it in the body, and judges them as one, as it is said, "He calls to the heavens above and to the earth to judge His people." "He calls to the heavens above" - this refers to the soul, "and to the earth to judge His people" - this is the body.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַנְטוֹנִינוּס לְרַבִּי מִפְּנֵי מָה חַמָּה יוֹצְאָה בַּמִּזְרָח וְשׁוֹקַעַת בְּמַעֲרָב אֲמַר לֵיהּ אִי הֲוָה אִיפְּכָא נָמֵי הָכִי הֲוָה אָמְרַתְּ לִי אֲמַר לֵיהּ הָכִי קָאָמֵינָא לָךְ מִפְּנֵי מָה שׁוֹקַעַת בַּמַּעֲרָב
human_translation: Antoninos said to Rabbi For what does the sun emerge in the east and set in the west? said to him: If it were the reverse, you would have also said that to me, said to him: This is what I am saying to you: For what does set in the west
llm_translation: He said to him, Antoninus said to Rabbi, "Why does the sun emerge in the east and set in the west?" He said to him, "If it were the opposite, you would ask the same question." He said to him, "That is what I meant - why does it set in the west?"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ כְּדֵי לִיתֵּן שָׁלוֹם לְקוֹנָהּ שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר 'וּצְבָא הַשָּׁמַיִם לְךָ מִשְׁתַּחֲוִים' אֲמַר לֵיהּ וְתֵיתֵי עַד פַּלְגָא דְרָקִיעַ וְתִתֵּן שְׁלָמָא וְתֵיעוֹל מִשּׁוּם פּוֹעֲלִים וּמִשּׁוּם עוֹבְרֵי דְרָכִים
human_translation: said to him: in order to greet its Creator, as it is stated: “And the hosts of heaven worship You” said to him: let come until the midpoint of the sky, and greet and enter due to workers and due to travelers,
llm_translation: He said to him, "In order to give peace to its Creator, as it is said, 'And the host of heaven bow down to You.'" He said to him, "And you should go up to the half of the firmament and give peace, and you should ascend because of the angels and because of those who pass on the roads."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר לוֹ אַנְטוֹנִינוּס לְרַבִּי נְשָׁמָה מֵאֵימָתַי נִיתְּנָה בָּאָדָם מִשְּׁעַת פְּקִידָה אוֹ מִשְּׁעַת יְצִירָה אָמַר לוֹ מִשְּׁעַת יְצִירָה אָמַר לוֹ אֶפְשָׁר חֲתִיכָה שֶׁל בָּשָׂר עוֹמֶדֶת שְׁלֹשָׁה יָמִים בְּלֹא מֶלַח וְאֵינָהּ מַסְרַחַת אֶלָּא מִשְּׁעַת פְּקִידָה אָמַר רַבִּי דָּבָר זֶה לִמְּדַנִי אַנְטוֹנִינוּס וּמִקְרָא מְסַיְּיעוֹ שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וּפְקֻדָּתְךָ שָׁמְרָה רוּחִי'
human_translation: And Antoninos said to Rabbi From when is soul placed in a person? from the moment of conception or from the moment of formation said to him: from the moment of formation said to him: possible a piece of meat stand three days without salt and not rot? Rather, from the moment of conception. Rabbi said: Antoninos taught me this matter, and a verse supports him, as it is stated: “And Your Providence [ pekudatekha ] has preserved my spirit”
llm_translation: And Antoninus said to Rabbi Neshama, "From when is the soul given to a person, from the time of appointment or from the time of formation?" He said to him, "From the time of formation." He said to him, "Is it possible that a piece of flesh stands for three days without salt and does not putrefy? Rather, from the time of appointment." Rabbi said, "This matter, Antoninus, has taught me, and a verse supports it, as it is said, 'And Your providence has preserved my spirit.'"

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר לוֹ אַנְטוֹנִינוּס לְרַבִּי מֵאֵימָתַי יֵצֶר הָרָע שׁוֹלֵט בָּאָדָם מִשְּׁעַת יְצִירָה אוֹ מִשְּׁעַת יְצִיאָה אָמַר לוֹ מִשְּׁעַת יְצִירָה אָמַר לוֹ אִם כֵּן בּוֹעֵט בִּמְעֵי אִמּוֹ וְיוֹצֵא אֶלָּא מִשְּׁעַת יְצִיאָה אָמַר רַבִּי דָּבָר זֶה לִמְּדַנִי אַנְטוֹנִינוּס וּמִקְרָא מְסַיְּיעוֹ שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר 'לַפֶּתַח חַטָּאת רֹבֵץ'
human_translation: And Antoninos said to Rabbi From when does the evil inclination dominate a person? from the moment of formation or from the moment of emergence said to him: from the moment of formation said to him: If so, kick his mother’s innards and emerge Rather, the evil inclination dominates a person from the moment of emergence Rabbi said: Antoninos taught me this matter, and a verse supports him, as it is stated: “Sin crouches at the entrance”
llm_translation: And Antoninus said to Rabbi, "From when does the evil inclination rule over a person, from the moment of formation or from the moment of birth?" He said to him, "From the moment of formation." He said to him, "If so, he kicks in his mother's womb and comes out." Rather, from the moment of birth, Rabbi said, "This matter I learned from Antoninus, and a verse supports him, as it is said, 'Sin crouches at the door.'"

hebrew_text: רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ רָמֵי כְּתִיב בָּם עִוֵּר וּפִסֵּחַ הָרָה וְיֹלֶדֶת יַחְדָּיו וּכְתִיב אָז יְדַלֵּג כָּאַיָּל פִּסֵּחַ וְתָרֹן לְשׁוֹן אִלֵּם כִּי נִבְקְעוּ בַמִּדְבָּר מַיִם וּנְחָלִים בָּעֲרָבָה הָא כֵּיצַד עוֹמְדִין בְּמוּמָן וּמִתְרַפְּאִין
human_translation: Reish Lakish raises a contradiction It is written: and with them the blind and the lame, the woman with child and the woman giving birth together” And it is written: “Then shall the lame man leap as a deer and the tongue of the mute sing; for in the wilderness shall waters break out, and streams in the desert” How so? will arise with their defects, and will be healed.
llm_translation: Reish Lakish raises a contradiction: It is written regarding them, "The blind and the lame, the pregnant woman and she who gives birth together." And it is written, "Then the lame shall leap like a deer, and the tongue of the mute shall sing." For water broke forth in the wilderness, and streams in the desert. How so? They stand with a blemish and are healed.

hebrew_text: עוּלָּא רָמֵי כְּתִיב בִּלַּע הַמָּוֶת לָנֶצַח וּמָחָה ה' דִּמְעָה מֵעַל כׇּל פָּנִים וּכְתִיב כִּי הַנַּעַר בֶּן מֵאָה שָׁנָה יָמוּת לֹא יִהְיֶה מִשָּׁם עוֹד עוּל יָמִים לָא קַשְׁיָא כָּאן בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל כָּאן בְּאוּמּוֹת הָעוֹלָם וְאוּמּוֹת הָעוֹלָם מַאי בָּעוּ הָתָם הָנָךְ דִּכְתִיב בְּהוּ וְעָמְדוּ זָרִים וְרָעוּ צֹאנְכֶם וּבְנֵי נֵכָר אִכָּרֵיכֶם וְכֹרְמֵיכֶם
human_translation: Ulla raises a contradiction. It is written: “He will swallow death forever; and the Lord will wipe tears from all faces” And it is written: “There shall be no more an infant a few days old then…for the youngest shall die one hundred years old” not difficult. here, with regard to the Jewish people, there, with regard to gentiles, And what do gentiles seek, that those about whom it is written: “And strangers shall stand and feed your flocks, and aliens shall be your plowmen and vinedressers”
llm_translation: Oula raised a contradiction: It is written, "He will swallow up death forever, and the Lord God will wipe away tears from all faces" (Isaiah 25:8). And it is written, "For the youth will die at the age of one hundred years, and the sinner who reaches the age of one hundred will be accursed" (Isaiah 65:20). Is there not a difficulty here in Israel, and a difficulty in the nations of the world? And what is the difficulty in the nations of the world? There, it is written, "And strangers will stand and feed your flocks, and foreigners will be your plowmen and your vinedressers" (Isaiah 61:5).

hebrew_text: רַב חִסְדָּא רָמֵי כְּתִיב וְחָפְרָה הַלְּבָנָה וּבוֹשָׁה הַחַמָּה כִּי מָלַךְ ה' צְבָאוֹת וּכְתִיב וְהָיָה אוֹר הַלְּבָנָה כְּאוֹר הַחַמָּה וְאוֹר הַחַמָּה יִהְיֶה שִׁבְעָתַיִם כְּאוֹר שִׁבְעַת הַיָּמִים לָא קַשְׁיָא כָּאן לִימוֹת הַמָּשִׁיחַ כָּאן לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda raises a contradiction. It is written: “Then the moon shall be confounded and the sun ashamed, when the Lord of hosts will reign And it is written: “And the light of the moon shall be as the light of the sun, and the light of the sun shall be sevenfold, as the light of seven days” not difficult. here, to the days of the Messiah, there, to the World-to-Come,
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda raises a contradiction: It is written, "And the moon shall be abashed, and the sun shall be ashamed, for the Lord of Hosts has reigned" (Isaiah 24:23), and it is written, "And the light of the moon shall be like the light of the sun, and the light of the sun shall be sevenfold, like the light of the seven days" (Isaiah 30:26). This is not difficult: here, referring to the days of the Messiah, and here, referring to the World to Come.

hebrew_text: וְלִשְׁמוּאֵל דְּאָמַר אֵין בֵּין הָעוֹלָם הַזֶּה לִימוֹת הַמָּשִׁיחַ אֶלָּא שִׁיעְבּוּד גָּלִיּוֹת בִּלְבַד לָא קַשְׁיָא כָּאן  בְּמַחֲנֵה צַדִּיקִים כָּאן  בְּמַחֲנֵה שְׁכִינָה
human_translation: And according to Shmuel, who says: The difference between this world and the messianic era is only subjugation of the exiles, not difficult. here, in the camp of the righteous; there, to the camp of the Divine Presence,
llm_translation: And to Samuel who said, "There is no difference between this world and the days of the Messiah except for the subjugation of the kingdoms alone." It is not difficult here, in the camp of the righteous, here in the camp of the Shechinah.

hebrew_text: רָבָא רָמֵי כְּתִיב אֲנִי אָמִית וַאֲחַיֶּה וּכְתִיב מָחַצְתִּי וַאֲנִי אֶרְפָּא אָמַר הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא מַה שֶּׁאֲנִי מֵמִית  אֲנִי מְחַיֶּה וַהֲדַר מַה שֶּׁמָּחַצְתִּי  וַאֲנִי אֶרְפָּא
human_translation: Rava raises a contradiction. It is written: “I will kill and I will bring to life” And it is written “I wounded and I will heal,” The Holy One, Blessed be He, is saying: What I kill, I bring to life, And then what I wounded, I will heal.
llm_translation: Rava raises a contradiction: It is written, "I kill and I make alive," and it is written, "I have wounded and I will heal." The Holy One, blessed be He, said: Just as I cause death, so too I bring to life; and just as I have wounded, so too I will heal.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן 'אֲנִי אָמִית וַאֲחַיֶּה' יָכוֹל שֶׁתְּהֵא מִיתָה בְּאֶחָד וְחַיִּים בְּאֶחָד כְּדֶרֶךְ שֶׁהָעוֹלָם נוֹהֵג  תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר 'מָחַצְתִּי וַאֲנִי אֶרְפָּא' מָה מְחִיצָה וּרְפוּאָה בְּאֶחָד  אַף מִיתָה וְחַיִּים בְּאֶחָד מִיכָּן תְּשׁוּבָה לָאוֹמְרִין אֵין תְּחִיַּית הַמֵּתִים מִן הַתּוֹרָה
human_translation: The Sages taught “I will kill and I will bring to life.” might that there will be death one and life one person, in the manner that the world operates. the verse states: “I wounded and I will heal.” Just as wounding and healing in one so too, death and life in one From here a response to say there is no resurrection of the dead from the Torah.
llm_translation: The sages taught: "I kill and I make alive." Could it be that death occurs in one moment and life in one moment, as the world normally operates? The Talmud teaches us to say, "I have wounded and I will heal." Just as wounding and healing occur in one moment, so too death and life occur in one moment. From here we learn that even repentance is not necessary, as they say, for the resurrection of the dead is not from the Torah.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא אָמַר רַבִּי מֵאִיר מִנַּיִין לִתְחִיַּית הַמֵּתִים מִן הַתּוֹרָה  שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר 'אָז יָשִׁיר מֹשֶׁה וּבְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל אֶת הַשִּׁירָה הַזֹּאת לַה' 'שָׁר' לֹא נֶאֱמַר אֶלָּא 'יָשִׁיר'  מִכָּאן לִתְחִיַּית הַמֵּתִים מִן הַתּוֹרָה כַּיּוֹצֵא בַּדָּבָר אַתָּה אוֹמֵר 'אָז יִבְנֶה יְהוֹשֻׁעַ מִזְבֵּחַ לַה'' 'בָּנָה' לֹא נֶאֱמַר אֶלָּא 'יִבְנֶה'  מִכָּאן לִתְחִיַּית הַמֵּתִים מִן הַתּוֹרָה
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Meir said: From where resurrection of the dead from the Torah? as it is stated: “Then Moses and the children of Israel will sing this song to the Lord” is not stated: Sang, rather, “they will sing” From here resurrection of the dead from the Torah. On a similar note, you say: “Then Joshua will build an altar to the Lord is not stated: Built, rather, “will build” From here, resurrection of the dead from the Torah.
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Meir said, from where is it derived regarding the resurrection of the dead from the Torah, as it is stated, "Then Moses and the children of Israel will sing this song to the Lord" (Exodus 15:1). It does not say 'will sing' but 'will sing.' From here it is derived regarding the resurrection of the dead from the Torah. Similarly, you can say, "Then Joshua will build an altar to the Lord" (Joshua 8:30). It does not say 'will build' but 'will build.' From here it is derived regarding the resurrection of the dead from the Torah.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה אָז יִבְנֶה שְׁלֹמֹה בָּמָה לִכְמוֹשׁ שִׁקֻּץ מוֹאָב הָכִי נָמֵי דְּיִבְנֶה אֶלָּא מַעֲלֶה עָלָיו הַכָּתוּב כְּאִילּוּ בָּנָה
human_translation: If that is so, “Then Solomon will build an altar for Chemosh the abomination of Moab” also will build rather, the verse ascribes him as though he built it,
llm_translation: Rather, from now on, then Solomon will build a high place for Chemosh, the abomination of Moab, as it is said, "as if he had built."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי מִנַּיִין לִתְחִיַּית הַמֵּתִים מִן הַתּוֹרָה  שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר אַשְׁרֵי יוֹשְׁבֵי בֵיתֶךָ עוֹד יְהַלְלוּךָ סֶּלָה הִילְּלוּךְ לֹא נֶאֱמַר אֶלָּא יְהַלְלוּךָ  מִכָּאן לִתְחִיַּית הַמֵּתִים מִן הַתּוֹרָה וְאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי כׇּל הָאוֹמֵר שִׁירָה בְּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה זוֹכֶה וְאוֹמְרָהּ לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר אַשְׁרֵי יוֹשְׁבֵי בֵיתֶךָ עוֹד יְהַלְלוּךָ סֶּלָה
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi says: From where resurrection of the dead from the Torah? as it is stated: “Happy are they who dwell in Your house; they will yet praise You, Selah” is not stated: They praised you, rather, “they will praise you” From here, resurrection of the dead from the Torah. And Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi says: Anyone who recites song in this world is privileged and recites it in the World-to-Come, as it is stated: “Happy are they who dwell in Your house; they will yet praise You, Selah.”
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: From where do we derive the resurrection of the dead from the Torah? As it is stated: "Happy are those who dwell in Your house, they will praise You forever. Selah." It does not say except "they will praise You." From here we derive the resurrection of the dead from the Torah. And Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: Anyone who recites a song in this world merits to recite it in the World to Come, as it is stated: "Happy are those who dwell in Your house, they will praise You forever. Selah."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִנַּיִין לִתְחִיַּית הַמֵּתִים מִן הַתּוֹרָה  שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר קוֹל צֹפַיִךְ נָשְׂאוּ קוֹל יַחְדָּו יְרַנֵּנוּ וְגוֹ' רִינְּנוּ לֹא נֶאֱמַר אֶלָּא יְרַנֵּנוּ  מִכָּאן לִתְחִיַּית הַמֵּתִים מִן הַתּוֹרָה וְאָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן עֲתִידִין כׇּל הַנְּבִיאִים כּוּלָּן אוֹמְרִים שִׁירָה בְּקוֹל אֶחָד שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר קוֹל צֹפַיִךְ נָשְׂאוּ קוֹל יַחְדָּו יְרַנֵּנוּ
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: From where resurrection of the dead from the Torah? as it is stated: “Your watchmen, they raise the voice; together shall they sing, is not stated: They sang, rather, shall they sing” From here resurrection of the dead from the Torah. And Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: All the prophets are all destined to recite song in one voice, as it is stated: “Your watchmen, they raise the voice; together shall they sing.”
llm_translation: Rabbi Hiyya bar Abba said in the name of Rabbi Yohanan: From where do we derive the resurrection of the dead from the Torah? As it is stated, "The voice of your watchmen—they raise their voice, together they will sing" (Isaiah 52:8). It does not say, "they will sing," but rather, "they will sing together." From here we derive the resurrection of the dead from the Torah. And Rabbi Hiyya bar Abba said in the name of Rabbi Yohanan: In the future, all the prophets will all sing with one voice, as it is stated, "The voice of your watchmen—they raise their voice, together they will sing."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב כׇּל הַמּוֹנֵעַ הֲלָכָה מִפִּי תַלְמִיד כְּאִילּוּ גּוֹזְלוֹ מִנַּחֲלַת אֲבוֹתָיו שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר תּוֹרָה צִוָּה לָנוּ מֹשֶׁה מוֹרָשָׁה קְהִלַּת יַעֲקֹב מוֹרָשָׁה הִיא לְכׇל יִשְׂרָאֵל מִשֵּׁשֶׁת יְמֵי בְּרֵאשִׁית אָמַר רַב חָנָא בַּר בִּיזְנָא אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן חֲסִידָא כׇּל הַמּוֹנֵעַ הֲלָכָה מִפִּי תַּלְמִיד אֲפִילּוּ עוּבָּרִין שֶׁבִּמְעֵי אִמָּן מְקַלְּלִין אוֹתוֹ שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר מֹנֵעַ בָּר
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Rav says: anyone who withholds halakha from the mouth of a student it is as though he robs him of the inheritance of his ancestors, as it is stated: “Moses commanded us the Torah, an inheritance of the congregation of Jacob” is an inheritance for all of the Jewish people from the six days of Creation. Rav Ḥana bar Bizna says Rabbi Shimon Ḥasida says: anyone who withholds halakha from the mouth of a student even fetuses in their mother’s womb curse him, as it is stated: “He who withholds bar ,
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: Anyone who prevents a halakha from the mouth of a student, it is as if he has robbed him of his ancestral heritage, as it is said, "The Torah that Moses commanded us is the inheritance of the congregation of Jacob" - it is an inheritance for all of Israel from the six days of creation. Rav Ḥanina bar Bizna said in the name of Rabbi Shimon Ḥasida: Anyone who prevents a halakha from the mouth of a student, even the transgressors in the generation of the mother's womb curse him, as it is said, "He who withholds the rod."

hebrew_text: יִקְּבֻהוּ לְאוֹם וְאֵין לְאוֹם אֶלָּא עוּבָּרִין שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וּלְאֹם מִלְּאֹם יֶאֱמָץ וְאֵין קַבֹּה אֶלָּא קְלָלָה שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר מָה אֶקֹּב לֹא קַבֹּה אֵל וְאֵין בַּר אֶלָּא תּוֹרָה שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר נַשְּׁקוּ בַר פֶּן יֶאֱנַף
human_translation: the people [ leom ] shall curse him [ yikkevuhu ], And leom nothing other than fetuses, as it is stated: and the one leom shall overcome the other leom ” And kabbo nothing other than curse, as it is stated “How can I curse one who is not cursed [ kabbo ] by God?” And bar nothing other than Torah, as it is stated: “Pay homage to bar lest He be angry”
llm_translation: He will pierce them for a nation, but not a nation, only for the Hebrews, as it is said, "And for a nation from a nation he will be strengthened." And "to pierce" is only a curse, as it is said, "What will I pierce if not the God?" And "son" is only Torah, as it is said, "Kiss the son lest he be angry."

hebrew_text: עוּלָּא בַּר יִשְׁמָעֵאל אוֹמֵר מְנַקְּבִין אוֹתוֹ כִּכְבָרָה  כְּתִיב הָכָא יִקְּבֻהוּ לְאוֹם וּכְתִיב הָתָם וַיִּקֹּב חֹר בְּדַלְתּוֹ וַאֲמַר אַבָּיֵי כִּי אוּכְלָא דְקַצָּרֵי
human_translation: Ulla bar Yishmael says: One perforates like a sieve It is written here: the people yikkevuhu ” and it is written there: “And he bored [ vayyikkov ] a hole in its lid of it” And Abaye says: like a launderers’ utensil
llm_translation: Ulla bar Yishmael says, "Pierce him like a kevareh." It is written here, "They shall pierce him for a nation," and it is written there, "And he pierced a hole in its door." And Abbaye said, "Like the hole of the reapers."

hebrew_text: וְאִם לִמְּדוֹ מָה שְׂכָרוֹ אָמַר רָבָא אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת זוֹכֶה לִבְרָכוֹת כְּיוֹסֵף שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וּבְרָכָה לְרֹאשׁ מַשְׁבִּיר וְאֵין מַשְׁבִּיר אֶלָּא יוֹסֵף שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וְיוֹסֵף הוּא [הַשַּׁלִּיט עַל הָאָרֶץ הוּא] הַמַּשְׁבִּיר לְכׇל עַם הָאָרֶץ
human_translation: And if one teaches what is his reward? Rava says Rav Sheshet says: He is privileged blessings like Joseph, as it is stated “But blessing shall be upon the head of one who provides [ mashbir ]” And mashbir no other than Joseph, as it is stated: “And Joseph was the governor of the land, and he was the provider [ hamashbir ] to all the people of the land”
llm_translation: And if they taught him what his reward is, Rava said, Rav Sheshet said: This one merits blessings like Joseph, as it is stated, "And a blessing for the head of the one who provides sustenance." And the one who provides sustenance is none other than Joseph, as it is stated, "And Joseph, he is the one who rules over the land, he is the one who provides sustenance to all the people of the land."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת כׇּל הַמְלַמֵּד תּוֹרָה בְּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה זוֹכֶה וּמְלַמְּדָהּ לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וּמַרְוֶה גַּם הוּא יוֹרֶה
human_translation: Rav Sheshet says: Anyone who teaches Torah in this world is privileged and teaches it in the World-to-Come, as it is stated: “And he who satisfies abundantly [ umarveh ] shall be satisfied himself [ yoreh ]”
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet said: Anyone who teaches Torah in this world merits and teaches it in the World to Come, as it is stated, "And the one who waters will also be watered."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא מִנַּיִין לִתְחִיַּית הַמֵּתִים מִן הַתּוֹרָה  שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר יְחִי רְאוּבֵן וְאַל יָמֹת יְחִי רְאוּבֵן  בָּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה וְאַל יָמֹת  לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא רָבִינָא אָמַר מֵהָכָא וְרַבִּים מִיְּשֵׁנֵי אַדְמַת עָפָר יָקִיצוּ אֵלֶּה לְחַיֵּי עוֹלָם וְאֵלֶּה לַחֲרָפוֹת לְדִרְאוֹן עוֹלָם רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר מֵהָכָא וְאַתָּה לֵךְ [לַקֵּץ] וְתָנוּחַ וְתַעֲמֹד לְגֹרָלְךָ לְקֵץ הַיָּמִין
human_translation: Rava says: From where resurrection of the dead from the Torah? as it is stated: “Let Reuben live and not die, “Let Reuben live” in this world “and not die” in the World-to-Come. Ravina says from here: “And many of those who sleep in the dust of the earth shall awaken, some to everlasting life, and some to reproaches and everlasting disgrace” Rav Ashi says from here: “But go you your way until the end be; and you shall rest, and arise to your lot at the end of days”
llm_translation: Rava said: From where is it derived in the Torah the resurrection of the dead, as it is stated, "May Reuben live and not die, may Reuben live in this world and not die in the world to come." Ravina said: From here, "And many of those who sleep in the dust of the earth shall awake, some to eternal life, and some to shame and everlasting contempt." Rab Ashi said: From here, "But you, go your way till the end; and you shall rest, and shall stand for your allotted portion at the end of days."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר כׇּל פַּרְנָס שֶׁמַּנְהִיג אֶת הַצִּבּוּר בְּנַחַת זוֹכֶה וּמַנְהִיגָם לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר כִּי מְרַחֲמָם יְנַהֲגֵם וְעַל מַבּוּעֵי מַיִם יְנַהֲלֵם
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar says: Any communal leader who leads the community calmly, is privileged and leads them in the World-to-Come, as it is stated: “For he that has compassion upon them will lead them, even by the springs of water shall he guide them”
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: "Every provider who leads the community with gentleness merits and leads them in the World to Come, as it is said, 'For He will lead them with compassion, and He will guide them to springs of water.'"

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר גְּדוֹלָה דֵּעָה שֶׁנִּיתְּנָה בֵּין שְׁתֵּי אוֹתִיּוֹת שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר כִּי אֵל דֵּעוֹת ה'
human_translation: And Rabbi Elazar says: Great is knowledge, as it was placed between two letters, as it is stated: “For a God of knowledge is the Lord”
llm_translation: And Rabbi Elazar said: Great is knowledge, for it was given between two letters, as it is said, "For the knowledge of the Lord."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר גָּדוֹל מִקְדָּשׁ שֶׁנִּיתַּן בֵּין שְׁתֵּי אוֹתִיּוֹת שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר פָּעַלְתָּ ה' מִקְּדָשׁ ה' כּוֹנְנוּ יָדֶיךָ מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב אַדָּא קַרְחִינָאָה אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה גְּדוֹלָה נְקָמָה שֶׁנִּיתְּנָה בֵּין שְׁתֵּי אוֹתִיּוֹת דִּכְתִיב אֵל נְקָמוֹת ה' אֵל נְקָמוֹת הוֹפִיַע
human_translation: And Rabbi Elazar says: Great is the Holy Temple, as it was placed between two letters, as it is stated: You have made, Lord, the Temple, Lord, which Your hands have prepared” Rav Adda Karḥina’a objects to If that is so, Great vengeance, as it was placed between two letters, as it is written: “God of vengeance, Lord, God of vengeance shine forth”
llm_translation: And Rabbi Elazar said: "Great is the sanctuary that was given between two vavs, as it is stated, 'You have worked, O Lord, the sanctuary, O Lord, which Your hands have established.' Rav Adda strengthened it, saying: Rather, from now on, great is the vengeance that was given between two vavs, as it is written, 'God of vengeance, O Lord, God of vengeance, shine forth.'"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ לְמִילְּתֵיהּ הָכִי נָמֵי כִּדְעוּלָּא דְּאָמַר עוּלָּא שְׁתֵּי הוֹפָעָיוֹת הַלָּלוּ לָמָּה  אַחַת לְמִידָּה טוֹבָה וְאַחַת לְמִדַּת פּוּרְעָנוּת
human_translation: said to him: In its context, indeed, in accordance with of Ulla. As Ulla says these two appearances: why One, for the attribute of good, and one, for the attribute of punishment,
llm_translation: He said to him regarding his matter thus: "It is stated as D'Ula said: 'Why are these two appearances?' One for good measure and one for retribution."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר כׇּל אָדָם שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ דֵּעָה כְּאִילּוּ נִבְנָה בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ בְּיָמָיו שֶׁזֶּה נִיתַּן בֵּין שְׁתֵּי אוֹתִיּוֹת וְזֶה נִיתַּן בֵּין שְׁתֵּי אוֹתִיּוֹת
human_translation: And Rabbi Elazar says: any person in whom there is knowledge, as though the Temple was built in his days, as this, was placed between two letters and that, was placed between two letters.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Elazar said: Any person who has knowledge is as if the Holy Temple was built in his days, for this is given between two letters and that is given between two letters.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר כׇּל אָדָם שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ דֵּעָה לְסוֹף מִתְעַשֵּׁר שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וּבְדַעַת חֲדָרִים יִמָּלְאוּ כׇּל הוֹן יָקָר וְנָעִים
human_translation: And Rabbi Elazar says: Any person in whom there is knowledge ultimately becomes wealthy, as it is stated: “And by knowledge are the chambers filled with all precious and pleasant riches”
llm_translation: And Rabbi Elazar said: Every person who has knowledge will ultimately become wealthy, as it is stated: "And through knowledge, the rooms will be filled with all precious and pleasant wealth."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר כׇּל אָדָם שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ דֵּעָה אָסוּר לְרַחֵם עָלָיו שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר כִּי לֹא עַם בִּינוֹת הוּא עַל כֵּן לֹא יְרַחֲמֶנּוּ עֹשֵׂהוּ וְיֹצְרוֹ לֹא יְחֻנֶּנּוּ
human_translation: And Rabbi Elazar says: any person in whom there is no knowledge, it is prohibited to have mercy upon him, as it is stated: “For it is a people of no understanding; therefore its Maker will have no mercy on them, and its Creator will show them no favor”
llm_translation: And Rabbi Elazar said: Any person who lacks knowledge, it is forbidden to have mercy upon him, as it is stated, "For they are a nation void of counsel, neither is there understanding in them" (Deuteronomy 32:28). Therefore, one should not have mercy on him who made him and formed him will not show him compassion.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר כׇּל הַנּוֹתֵן פִּיתּוֹ לְמִי שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ דֵּעָה יִסּוּרִין בָּאִין עָלָיו שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר לַחְמְךָ יָשִׂימוּ מָזוֹר תַּחְתֶּיךָ אֵין תְּבוּנָה בּוֹ וְאֵין מָזוֹר אֶלָּא יִסּוּרִין שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וַיַּרְא אֶפְרַיִם אֶת חׇלְיוֹ וִיהוּדָה אֶת מְזֹרוֹ
human_translation: And Rabbi Elazar says: anyone who gives his bread to one without knowledge, afflictions befall him, as it is stated: “They who eat your bread will place mazor under you, in whom there is no discernment” And mazor nothing other than afflictions, as it is stated: “And Ephraim saw his sickness and Judah his wound [ mezoro ]”
llm_translation: And Rabbi Elazar said: Anyone who gives his bread to one who lacks understanding, afflictions come upon him, as it is said, "They shall cast your bread upon the waters, for you shall find it after many days." There is no understanding in him, and 'mazor' means nothing but afflictions, as it is said, "And Ephraim saw his sickness, and Judah his wound."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר כׇּל אָדָם שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ דֵּעָה  לְסוֹף גּוֹלֶה שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר לָכֵן גָּלָה עַמִּי מִבְּלִי דָעַת
human_translation: And Rabbi Elazar says: Any person in whom there is no knowledge is ultimately exiled, as it is stated: “Therefore my people are exiled, for lack of knowledge”
llm_translation: And Rabbi Elazar said: Any person who lacks knowledge, to the end he will be exiled, as it is stated, "Therefore my people are gone into captivity, because they have no knowledge" (Isaiah 5:13).

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר כׇּל בַּיִת שֶׁאֵין דִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה נִשְׁמָעִים בּוֹ בַּלַּיְלָה  אֵשׁ אוֹכַלְתּוֹ שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר כׇּל חֹשֶׁךְ טָמוּן לִצְפּוּנָיו תְּאׇכְלֵהוּ אֵשׁ לֹא נֻפָּח יֵרַע שָׂרִיד בְּאׇהֳלוֹ אֵין שָׂרִיד אֶלָּא תַּלְמִיד חָכָם שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וּבַשְּׂרִידִים אֲשֶׁר ה' קֹרֵא
human_translation: And Rabbi Elazar says: any house in which there are no matters of Torah heard at night, the fire consumes it, as it is stated: “All darkness is laid up for his treasures, a fire not fanned shall consume him; it shall go ill with a sarid in his tent” Sarid no but a Torah scholar, as it is stated: “And among the seridim , those whom the Lord shall call”
llm_translation: And Rabbi Elazar said: "Every house in which the words of Torah are not heard at night, a fire consumes it, as it is stated: 'All darkness is hidden treasures; a fire will consume it, not blown upon; what is left in his tent will be devoured.' There is no remnant except for a Torah scholar, as it is stated: 'And in the remnant that the Lord shall call.'"

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר כׇּל שֶׁאֵינוֹ מְהַנֶּה תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים מִנְּכָסָיו אֵינוֹ רוֹאֶה סִימַן בְּרָכָה לְעוֹלָם שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר אֵין שָׂרִיד לְאׇכְלוֹ עַל כֵּן לֹא יָחִיל טוּבוֹ אֵין שָׂרִיד אֶלָּא תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וּבַשְּׂרִידִים אֲשֶׁר ה' קֹרֵא
human_translation: And Rabbi Elazar says: Anyone who does not benefit Torah scholars from his property never sees a sign of blessing, as it is stated: “None of his food shall remain [ sarid ]; therefore his prosperity shall not endure” Sarid no but Torah scholars, as it is stated: “And among the seridim , those whom the Lord shall call.”
llm_translation: And Rabbi Elazar said: Anyone who does not derive benefit for Torah scholars from his possessions will never see a sign of blessing in his life, as it is stated: "There is no remnant for him who eats" (Zechariah 11:9). Therefore, his goodness will not endure. The remnant refers only to Torah scholars, as it is stated: "And to the remnant whom the Lord calls" (Joel 3:5).

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר כׇּל שֶׁאֵינוֹ מְשַׁיֵּיר פַּת עַל שֻׁלְחָנוֹ  אֵינוֹ רוֹאֶה סִימַן בְּרָכָה לְעוֹלָם שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר אֵין שָׂרִיד לְאׇכְלוֹ עַל כֵּן לֹא יָחִיל טוּבוֹ
human_translation: And Rabbi Elazar says: Anyone who does not leave bread on his table never sees a sign of blessing, as it is stated: “None of his food shall remain; therefore his prosperity shall not endure.”
llm_translation: And Rabbi Elazar said: Anyone who does not leave a piece of bread on his table does not see a sign of blessing forever, as it is stated: "There is no remnant for him that eateth it" (Habakkuk 1:16). Therefore, his goodness shall not endure.

hebrew_text: וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר כׇּל הַמְשַׁיַּיר פְּתִיתִים עַל שֻׁלְחָנוֹ כְּאִילּוּ עוֹבֵד עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר הָעֹרְכִים לַגַּד שֻׁלְחָן וְהַמְמַלְאִים לַמְנִי מִמְסָךְ לָא קַשְׁיָא הָא  דְּאִיכָּא שְׁלֵימָה בַּהֲדֵיהּ הָא  דְּלֵיכָּא שְׁלֵימָה בַּהֲדֵיהּ
human_translation: But doesn’t Rabbi Elazar say: anyone who leaves pieces on his table, it is as if he worships idols, as it is stated: “Who prepare a table for Fortune [ Gad ] and offer blended wine for Destiny” not difficult: This when there is a whole with that when there is no whole with
llm_translation: And Rabbi Elazar said: Anyone who leaves crumbs on his table is as if he worships foreign idols, as it is said, "Those who set the table of Fortune and those who fill the cup of Destiny" (Isaiah 65:11). This is difficult: where there is completeness in it, where there is not completeness in it.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר כׇּל הַמַּחְלִיף בְּדִיבּוּרוֹ כְּאִילּוּ עוֹבֵד עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה  כְּתִיב הָכָא וְהָיִיתִי בְעֵינָיו כִּמְתַעְתֵּעַ וּכְתִיב הָתָם הֶבֶל הֵמָּה מַעֲשֵׂה תַּעְתֻּעִים
human_translation: And Rabbi Elazar says: anyone who amends in his speech, it is as though he worships idols. it is written here, “And I shall seem to him a deceiver [ metate’a ]” and it is written there “They are vanity, the work of deception [ tatuim ]”
llm_translation: And Rabbi Elazar said: Anyone who changes his speech, it is as if he worships idols. It is written here, "And I will be to him as a deceitful bow," and it is written there, "They are vanity, the work of errors."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר כׇּל הַמִּסְתַּכֵּל בְּעֶרְוָה קַשְׁתּוֹ נִנְעֶרֶת שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר עֶרְיָה תֵעוֹר קַשְׁתֶּךָ
human_translation: And Rabbi Elazar says: anyone who looks at nakedness [ erva ], his bow is emptied, as it is stated: “Your bow is stripped bare [ erya ]”
llm_translation: And Rabbi Elazar said: "Anyone who gazes at nakedness, his bow is loosened," as it is said: "Your nakedness shall be uncovered, your shame shall be seen" (Isaiah 47:3).

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר לְעוֹלָם הָוֵי קָבֵל וְקַיָּים אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא אַף אֲנַן נָמֵי תְּנֵינָא בַּיִת אָפֵל אֵין פּוֹתְחִין לוֹ חַלּוֹנוֹת לִרְאוֹת נִגְעוֹ שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ
human_translation: And Rabbi Elazar says: Forever be in the dark, and exist. Rabbi Zeira says: We learn as well a dark house, one does not open windows to it to see its leprosy, Conclude from
llm_translation: And Rabbi Elazar said: Always be accepting and enduring. Rabbi Zeira said: We also learned in a dark house, one does not open windows to see its blemish. Learn from it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי טָבִי אָמַר רַבִּי יֹאשִׁיָּה מַאי דִּכְתִיב שְׁאוֹל וְעֹצֶר רָחַם אֶרֶץ לֹא שָׂבְעָה מַּיִם וְכִי מָה עִנְיַן שְׁאוֹל אֵצֶל רֶחֶם אֶלָּא לוֹמַר לְךָ מָה רֶחֶם מַכְנִיס וּמוֹצִיא אַף שְׁאוֹל מַכְנִיס וּמוֹצִיא
human_translation: Rabbi Tavi says Rabbi Yoshiya says: What which is written: the grave, and the barren womb, and earth that does not receive sufficient water” And what does a grave have to do with a womb? Rather, to say to you: Just as a womb takes in and gives forth, so too a grave takes in and gives forth,
llm_translation: Rabbi Tavi said, Rabbi Yoshiyah said: What is the meaning of what is written, "Sheol and the barren womb, earth is never satisfied with water"? What connection does Sheol have with the womb? Rather, to tell you: Just as the womb receives and brings forth, so too Sheol receives and brings forth.

hebrew_text: וַהֲלֹא דְּבָרִים קַל וְחוֹמֶר וּמָה רֶחֶם שֶׁמַּכְנִיסִין בּוֹ בַּחֲשַׁאי  מוֹצִיאִין מִמֶּנּוּ בְּקוֹלֵי קוֹלוֹת שְׁאוֹל שֶׁמַּכְנִיסִין בּוֹ בְּקוֹלוֹת  אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁמּוֹצִיאִין מִמֶּנּוּ בְּקוֹלֵי קוֹלוֹת מִיכָּן תְּשׁוּבָה לָאוֹמְרִין אֵין תְּחִיַּית הַמֵּתִים מִן הַתּוֹרָה
human_translation: And are matters not a fortiori : If a womb, into which one introduces in secret, one removes from it by loud sounds the grave, into which one introduces with sounds is it not right that one removes by loud sounds From here a response to say: There is no resurrection of the dead from the Torah.
llm_translation: And are not these things a fortiori: Just as the womb, into which one enters silently, one exits from it with loud voices, so too, the pit of destruction, into which one enters with loud voices, it is not fitting that one should exit from it with loud voices. From here, repentance is said to be not from the Torah.

hebrew_text: תָּנָא דְּבֵי אֵלִיָּהוּ צַדִּיקִים שֶׁעָתִיד הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לְהַחְיוֹתָן אֵינָן חוֹזְרִין לַעֲפָרָן שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר 'וְהָיָה הַנִּשְׁאָר בְּצִיּוֹן וְהַנּוֹתָר בִּירוּשָׁלִַים קָדוֹשׁ יֵאָמֶר לוֹ כׇּל הַכָּתוּב לַחַיִּים בִּירוּשָׁלָיִם' מָה קָדוֹשׁ לְעוֹלָם קַיָּים אַף הֵם לְעוֹלָם קַיָּימִין
human_translation: The school of Eliyahu taught: The righteous whom the Holy One, Blessed be He, is destined to resurrect do not return to their dust, as it is stated: “And it shall come to pass, that he who remains in Zion and he who remains in Jerusalem shall be called holy, anyone who is written unto life in Jerusalem” Just as Holy One exists forever, so too will they exist forever.
llm_translation: It was taught in the school of Elijah: Righteous individuals whom the Holy One, blessed be He, is destined to revive, do not return to their dust, as it is stated, "And it shall come to pass that he who is left in Zion and he who remains in Jerusalem shall be called holy—everyone who is recorded for life in Jerusalem." Just as the holiness of Jerusalem is eternal, so too are they eternal.

hebrew_text: וְאִם תֹּאמַר אוֹתָן שָׁנִים שֶׁעָתִיד הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לְחַדֵּשׁ בָּהֶן אֶת עוֹלָמוֹ שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר 'וְנִשְׂגַּב ה' לְבַדּוֹ בַּיּוֹם הַהוּא' צַדִּיקִים מָה הֵן עוֹשִׂין  הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא עוֹשֶׂה לָהֶם כְּנָפַיִם כִּנְשָׁרִים וְשָׁטִין עַל פְּנֵי הַמָּיִם שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר 'עַל כֵּן לֹא נִירָא בְּהָמִיר אָרֶץ וּבְמוֹט הָרִים בְּלֵב יַמִּים' וְשֶׁמָּא תֹּאמַר יֵשׁ לָהֶם צַעַר  תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר 'וְקוֹיֵ ה' יַחֲלִיפוּ כֹחַ יַעֲלוּ אֵבֶר כַּנְּשָׁרִים יָרוּצוּ וְלֹא יִיגָעוּ יֵלְכוּ וְלֹא יִיעָפוּ'
human_translation: And if you say: those years when the Holy One, Blessed be He, is destined to renew His world, as it is stated: “And the Lord alone shall be exalted on that day” what are the righteous do? The Holy One, Blessed be He, make wings like eagles for them and fly over the surface of the water, as it is stated: “Therefore, we will not fear when God changes the land, and when the mountains are moved in the midst of the sea” And lest you say suffering the verse states: “But they who wait for the Lord shall renew their strength; they shall mount up with wings as eagles; they shall run, and not be weary; they shall walk, and not tire”
llm_translation: And if you will say those two that the Holy One, blessed be He, is destined to renew His world with them, as it is stated, "And the Lord alone shall be exalted on that day," what do the righteous do? The Holy One, blessed be He, makes wings for them like eagles and they swim on the face of the water, as it is stated, "Therefore we will not fear when the earth changes and when mountains collapse into the heart of the seas." And perhaps you will say they have pain, the Scripture teaches to say, "But they that wait upon the Lord shall renew their strength; they shall mount up with wings as eagles; they shall run, and not be weary; they shall walk, and not faint."

hebrew_text: וְנֵילַף מִמֵּתִים שֶׁהֶחְיָה יְחֶזְקֵאל סָבַר לַהּ כְּמַאן דְּאָמַר בֶּאֱמֶת מָשָׁל הָיָה
