human_translation: And let us derive from the dead that Ezekiel revived holds in accordance with the one who says: In truth, was a parable,
llm_translation: And it was taught: Regarding the resurrection of the dead, that Ezekiel caused to live, he held the opinion like the one who said, "In truth, it was a parable."

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר מֵתִים שֶׁהֶחְיָה יְחֶזְקֵאל עָמְדוּ עַל רַגְלֵיהֶם וְאָמְרוּ שִׁירָה וָמֵתוּ מָה שִׁירָה אָמְרוּ 'ה' מֵמִית בְּצֶדֶק וּמְחַיֶּה בְּרַחֲמִים' רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר שִׁירָה זוֹ אָמְרוּ 'ה' מֵמִית וּמְחַיֶּה מוֹרִיד שְׁאוֹל וַיָּעַל' רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר אֱמֶת מָשָׁל הָיָה
human_translation: as it is taught Rabbi Eliezer says: The dead that Ezekiel revived stood on their feet and recited song and died. And what song did they recite? The Lord kills with justice and gives life with mercy. Rabbi Yehoshua says this song they recited: “The Lord kills, and gives life; He lowers to the grave and elevates” Rabbi Yehuda says: truth was a parable.
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Eliezer says, "The dead whom Ezekiel revived stood on their feet and sang a song, and then died again." What song did they sing? They said, 'The Lord kills and brings to life; He brings down to Sheol and raises up.' Rabbi Yehoshua says, "This is the song they sang: 'The Lord kills and brings to life; He brings down to Sheol and raises up.'" Rabbi Yehuda says, "It was a true parable."

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה אִם אֱמֶת לָמָּה מָשָׁל וְאִם מָשָׁל לָמָּה אֱמֶת אֶלָּא בֶּאֱמֶת מָשָׁל הָיָה רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בְּנוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי אוֹמֵר מֵתִים שֶׁהֶחְיָה יְחֶזְקֵאל עָלוּ לְאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל וְנָשְׂאוּ נָשִׁים וְהוֹלִידוּ בָּנִים וּבָנוֹת עָמַד רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בְּתֵירָא עַל רַגְלָיו וְאָמַר 'אֲנִי מִבְּנֵי בְנֵיהֶם וְהַלָּלוּ תְּפִילִּין שֶׁהִנִּיחַ לִי אֲבִי אַבָּא מֵהֶם'
human_translation: Rabbi Neḥemya said to If truth, why a parable, and if a parable, why truth? Rather, In truth, it was a parable. Rabbi Eliezer, son of Rabbi Yosei HaGelili, says: dead that Ezekiel revived ascended to Eretz Yisrael and married wives and fathered sons and daughters. Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira stood on his feet and said: I am a descendant of their sons, and these are phylacteries that my father’s father left me from them.
llm_translation: He said to him Rabbi Nechemiah, if truth why parable and if parable why truth rather in truth parable was Rabbi Eliezer son of Rabbi Yosei the Galilean says the dead that Ezekiel revived went up to the land of Israel and married women and bore sons and daughters Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira stood on his feet and said I am from their descendants and these are the phylacteries that my grandfather's grandfather left for me.

hebrew_text: וּמַאן נִינְהוּ מֵתִים שֶׁהֶחְיָה יְחֶזְקֵאל
human_translation: And who are dead that Ezekiel revived?
llm_translation: And who are they, the dead that Ezekiel revived?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אֵלּוּ בְּנֵי אֶפְרַיִם שֶׁמָּנוּ לַקֵּץ וְטָעוּ שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וּבְנֵי אֶפְרַיִם שׁוּתָלַח וּבֶרֶד בְּנוֹ וְתַחַת בְּנוֹ וְאֶלְעָדָה בְנוֹ וְתַחַת בְּנוֹ וְזָבָד בְּנוֹ וְשׁוּתֶלַח בְּנוֹ וְעֵזֶר (וְאֶלְעָזָר) [וְאֶלְעָד] וַהֲרָגוּם אַנְשֵׁי גַת הַנּוֹלָדִים בָּאָרֶץ וְגוֹ' וּכְתִיב וַיִּתְאַבֵּל אֶפְרַיִם אֲבִיהֶם יָמִים רַבִּים וַיָּבֹאוּ אֶחָיו לְנַחֲמוֹ
human_translation: Rav says: These were the descendants of Ephraim who calculated of the end and erred as it is stated: “And the sons of Ephraim; Shuthelah, and Bered his son, and Tahath his son, and Eleadah his son, and Tahath his son. And Zabad his son, and Shuthelah his son, and Ezer and Elead whom the men of Gath that were born in the land slew, and it is written: “And Ephraim their father mourned many days, and his brothers came to comfort him”
llm_translation: Rav said: These are the sons of Ephraim who were designated for the end and erred, as it is stated, "And the sons of Ephraim: Shuthelah, and Bered his son, and Tahath his son, and Eleadah his son, and Tahath his son, and Zabad his son, and Shuthelah his son, and Ezer (and Elead) and the men of Gath, born in the land, killed them." And it is written, "And Ephraim their father mourned many days, and his brothers came to comfort him."

hebrew_text: וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר אֵלּוּ בְּנֵי אָדָם שֶׁכָּפְרוּ בִּתְחִיַּית הַמֵּתִים שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וַיֹּאמֶר אֵלַי בֶּן אָדָם הָעֲצָמוֹת הָאֵלֶּה כׇּל בֵּית יִשְׂרָאֵל הֵמָּה הִנֵּה אֹמְרִים יָבְשׁוּ עַצְמוֹתֵינוּ וְאָבְדָה תִקְוָתֵנוּ נִגְזַרְנוּ לָנוּ
human_translation: And Shmuel says: These people who denied the resurrection of the dead, as it is stated: “Then He said to me: Son of man, these bones are the whole house of Israel; behold, they say: Our bones are dried and our hope is lost; we are cut off”
llm_translation: And Samuel said: These are the people who denied the resurrection of the dead, as it is stated, "And He said to me: 'Son of man, can these bones live?' And I answered: 'O Lord God, You alone know.'" (Ezekiel 37:3) Behold, the House of Israel says, "Our bones are dried up, and our hope is lost; we are doomed." (Ezekiel 37:11)

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר אֵלּוּ בְּנֵי אָדָם שֶׁאֵין בָּהֶן לַחְלוּחִית שֶׁל מִצְוָה שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר הָעֲצָמוֹת הַיְבֵשׁוֹת שִׁמְעוּ דְּבַר ה'
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya bar Abba says: These people in whom there not the moist of a mitzva, as it is stated: “The dry bones, hear the word of the Lord”
llm_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya bar Abba said: These are the people who do not have the charm of a mitzvah, as it is stated, "Hear the word of the Lord, you dry bones."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יִצְחָק נַפָּחָא אָמַר אֵלּוּ בְּנֵי אָדָם שֶׁחִיפּוּ אֶת הַהֵיכָל כּוּלּוֹ שְׁקָצִים וּרְמָשִׂים שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וָאָבוֹא וָאֶרְאֶה וְהִנֵּה כׇל תַּבְנִית רֶמֶשׂ וּבְהֵמָה שֶׁקֶץ וְכׇל גִּלּוּלֵי בֵּית יִשְׂרָאֵל מְחֻקֶּה עַל הַקִּיר סָבִיב וְגוֹ' וּכְתִיב הָתָם וְהֶעֱבִירַנִי עֲלֵיהֶם סָבִיב סָבִיב
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzḥak Nappaḥa says: These are the people who covered the Sanctuary with repugnant creatures and creeping animals, as it is stated: “So I entered and saw and behold, every form of creeping animal and repugnant animal, and all the idols of the house of Israel, etched upon the wall around” and it is written there “And he passed me over them around and around”
llm_translation: Rabbi Yitzchak Nappacha said: These are the people who defiled the entire Temple with abominations and creeping things, as it is stated, "And I came and saw, and behold, every form of creeping thing and detestable beast, and all the idols of the house of Israel, portrayed upon the wall round about" (Ezekiel 8:10).

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר אֵלּוּ מֵתִים שֶׁבְּבִקְעַת דּוּרָא וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִנְּהַר אֵשֶׁל עַד רַבַּת בִּקְעַת דּוּרָא שֶׁבְּשָׁעָה שֶׁהִגְלָה נְבוּכַדְנֶצַּר הָרָשָׁע אֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל הָיוּ בָּהֶן בַּחוּרִים שֶׁהָיוּ מְגַנִּין אֶת הַחַמָּה בְּיוֹפְיָין וְהָיוּ כַּשְׂדִּיּוֹת רוֹאוֹת אוֹתָן וְשׁוֹפְעוֹת זָבוּת אָמְרוּ לְבַעֲלֵיהֶן וּבַעֲלֵיהֶן לַמֶּלֶךְ צִוָּה הַמֶּלֶךְ וַהֲרָגוּם וַעֲדַיִין הָיוּ שׁוֹפְעוֹת זָבוּת צִוָּה הַמֶּלֶךְ וּרְמָסוּם
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: These are the dead from the Dura Valley And Rabbi Yoḥanan says: from the Eshel River to Rabat, the Dura Valley. As, at the time that Nebuchadnezzar the wicked exiled the Jewish people there were among them youths who overshadowed the sun with their beauty, and the Chaldean women would see them, and and discharge the flow of a zava . told their husbands, and their husbands the king. The king ordered and executed them. And were still discharging the flow of a zava . The king ordered and trampled them
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: These are the dead in the Valley of Dura. And Rabbi Yochanan said: From the Eshel River until the Ravat Valley of Dura, at the time when Nebuchadnezzar the wicked exiled Israel, there were among them young men who would shield the sun with their beauty, and the Chaldean women would see them and their noses would run. They said to their husbands, and their husbands to the king, the king commanded and they killed them. Yet their noses still ran. The king commanded and they trampled them.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁהִפִּיל נְבוּכַדְנֶצַּר הָרָשָׁע אֶת חֲנַנְיָה מִישָׁאֵל וַעֲזַרְיָה לְכִבְשַׁן הָאֵשׁ אָמַר לוֹ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לִיחֶזְקֵאל 'לֵךְ וְהַחְיֵיה מֵתִים בְּבִקְעַת דּוּרָא' כֵּיוָן שֶׁהֶחְיָיה אוֹתָן בָּאוּ עֲצָמוֹת וְטָפְחוּ לוֹ לְאוֹתוֹ רָשָׁע עַל פָּנָיו אָמַר 'מָה טִיבָן שֶׁל אֵלּוּ' אָמְרוּ לוֹ 'חַבְרֵיהֶן שֶׁל אֵלּוּ מְחַיֶּיה מֵתִים בְּבִקְעַת דּוּרָא' פָּתַח וְאָמַר 'אָתוֹהִי כְּמָה רַבְרְבִין וְתִמְהוֹהִי כְּמָה תַקִּיפִין מַלְכוּתֵיהּ מַלְכוּת עָלַם וְשׇׁלְטָנֵהּ עִם דָּר וְדָר' וְגוֹ'
human_translation: The Sages taught At the moment that Nebuchadnezzar the wicked cast Hananiah, Mishael, and Azariah into the fiery furnace, the Holy One, Blessed be He, said to Ezekiel: Go and revive the dead in the Dura Valley. Once revived them, the bones came and struck that wicked in his face. said: What is the nature of these? said to him: The friend of these is reviving dead in the Dura Valley. began and said: “How great are His signs and how mighty are His wonders; His kingdom is an everlasting kingdom and His dominion is from generation to generation”
llm_translation: The sages taught: At the time when Nebuchadnezzar the wicked threw Hananiah, Mishael, and Azariah into the fiery furnace, the Holy One, blessed be He, said to Ezekiel, "Go and revive the dead in the valley of Dura." Once he revived them, their bones came and clung to that wicked one's face. He said, "What is the quality of these?" They said to him, "Their companions revive the dead in the valley of Dura." He opened and said, "How many are His officers, and how mighty His rulership, His kingdom is an eternal kingdom, and His dominion endures throughout all generations," and so on.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק יוּצַק זָהָב רוֹתֵחַ לְתוֹךְ פִּיו שֶׁל אוֹתוֹ רָשָׁע שֶׁאִילְמָלֵא (לֹא) בָּא מַלְאָךְ וּסְטָרוֹ עַל פִּיו בִּיקֵּשׁ לְגַנּוֹת כׇּל שִׁירוֹת וְתִשְׁבָּחוֹת שֶׁאָמַר דָּוִד בְּסֵפֶר תְּהִלִּים
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzḥak says: Molten gold should be poured into the mouth of that wicked that if an angel had not come and struck him on his mouth have sought to overshadow all the songs and praises that David recited in the book of Psalms.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yitzchak said: "Molten gold was poured into the mouth of that wicked person, for had the angel not come and sealed his mouth, he sought to nullify all the songs and praises that David said in the Book of Psalms."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן שִׁשָּׁה נִסִּים נַעֲשׂוּ בְּאוֹתוֹ הַיּוֹם וְאֵלּוּ הֵן צָף הַכִּבְשָׁן וְנִפְרַץ הַכִּבְשָׁן וְהוּמַק סוֹדוֹ וְנֶהְפַּךְ צֶלֶם עַל פָּנָיו וְנִשְׂרְפוּ אַרְבַּע מַלְכִיּוֹת וְהֶחְיָה יְחֶזְקֵאל אֶת הַמֵּתִים בְּבִקְעַת דּוּרָא
human_translation: The Sages taught Six miracles were performed on that day and they are: The furnace rose and the furnace was breached; and its limestone dissipated; and the graven image fell on its face; and four monarchies, were burned; and Ezekiel revived the dead in the Dura Valley.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: Six miracles occurred on that day, and these are they: The furnace of the Chaldeans floated, the furnace of the Chaldeans was broken, the structure of its stones was upturned, the image on its face was reversed, four kingdoms were burned, and Ezekiel revived the dead in the valley of Dura.

hebrew_text: וְכוּלְּהוּ גְּמָרָא וְאַרְבַּע מַלְכִיּוֹת קְרָא דִּכְתִיב וּנְבוּכַדְנֶצַּר מַלְכָּא שְׁלַח לְמִכְנַשׁ לַאֲחַשְׁדַּרְפְּנַיָּא סִגְנַיָּא וּפַחֲוָתָא אֲדַרְגָּזְרַיָּא גְדָבְרַיָּא דְּתָבְרַיָּא תִּפְתָּיֵא וְכֹל שִׁלְטֹנֵי מְדִינָתָא וְגוֹ' וּכְתִיב אִיתַי גֻּבְרִין יְהוּדָאִין וּכְתִיב וּמִתְכַּנְּשִׁין אֲחַשְׁדַּרְפְּנַיָּא סִגְנַיָּא וּפַחֲוָתָא וְהַדָּבְרֵי מַלְכָּא חָזַיִן לְגֻבְרַיָּא אִלֵּךְ וְגוֹ'
human_translation: And all of tradition. And the four monarchies a verse, as it is written: “Then Nebuchadnezzar the king sent to gather together the satraps, the prefects and the governors, the counselors, the treasurers, the justices, the magistrates and all the rulers of the provinces” And it is written: “There are certain Jews… And it is written “And the satraps, the prefects, the governors, and the king’s counselors gathered and saw these men”
llm_translation: The Gemara and four kings scripture as it is written: "And Nebuchadnezzar the king sent to gather together the satraps, the deputies, the governors, the counselors, the treasurers, the judges, the magistrates, and all the rulers of the provinces, to come to the dedication of the image which Nebuchadnezzar the king had set up." And it is written: "There came certain Jews." And it is written: "Then the satraps, the deputies, and the governors, the counselors, the treasurers, the judges, the magistrates, and all the rulers of the provinces, were gathered together unto the dedication of the image that Nebuchadnezzar the king had set up."

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי דְּבֵי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב אֲפִילּוּ בִּשְׁעַת הַסַּכָּנָה לֹא יְשַׁנֶּה אָדָם אֶת עַצְמוֹ מִן הָרַבָּנוּת (שֶׁלּוֹ) שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר 'בֵּאדַיִן גֻּבְרַיָּא אִלֵּךְ כְּפִתוּ בְּסַרְבָּלֵיהוֹן פַּטְּשֵׁיהוֹן וְכַרְבְּלָתְהוֹן' וְגוֹ'
human_translation: The school of Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov teaches: Even during a period of danger, a person should not deviate from his prominence as it is stated: “Then these men were bound in their mantles, their tunics, and their hats,
llm_translation: The schools of Rabbi Eliezer ben Jacob taught: Even at a time of danger, a person should not exempt himself from the community leadership, as it is stated, "Then my lords, go, serve yourselves" (Genesis 18:5) and so on.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says:
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yochanan

hebrew_text: גְּדוֹלִים צַדִּיקִים יוֹתֵר מִמַּלְאֲכֵי הַשָּׁרֵת שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר עָנֵה וְאָמַר הָא אֲנָא חָזֵי גֻּבְרִין אַרְבְּעָה שְׁרַיִן מַהְלְכִין בְּגוֹ נוּרָא וַחֲבָל לָא אִיתַי בְּהוֹן וְרֵוֵהּ דִּי רְבִיעָאָה דָּמֵה לְבַר אֱלָהִין
human_translation: The righteous are greater than the ministering angels, as it is stated: “He answered and said: I see four men unbound, walking in the midst of the fire, and they have no hurt; and the appearance of the fourth is like a son of the gods”
llm_translation: Great are the righteous more than the ministering angels, as it is said, "Behold, I see four men loose, walking in the midst of the fire, and they have no hurt; and the appearance of the fourth is like a son of God."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי תַּנְחוּם בַּר חֲנִילַאי בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁיָּצְאוּ חֲנַנְיָה מִישָׁאֵל וַעֲזַרְיָה מִכִּבְשַׁן הָאֵשׁ בָּאוּ כׇּל אוּמּוֹת הָעוֹלָם וְטָפְחוּ לְשׂוֹנְאֵיהֶן שֶׁל יִשְׂרָאֵל עַל פְּנֵיהֶם אָמְרוּ לָהֶם יֵשׁ לָכֶם אֱלוֹהַּ כָּזֶה וְאַתֶּם מִשְׁתַּחֲוִים לַצֶּלֶם מִיָּד פָּתְחוּ וְאָמְרוּ לָךְ ה' הַצְּדָקָה וְלָנוּ בֹּשֶׁת הַפָּנִים כַּיּוֹם הַזֶּה
human_translation: Rabbi Tanḥum bar Ḥanilai says: At the moment that Hananiah, Mishael, and Azariah emerged from the fiery furnace, all the nations of the world came and struck the enemies of Israel, in the face said to them: You have a God like that and you bow to the graven image? Immediately began and said: “Lord, righteousness is Yours, but we are shamefaced, as of this day”
llm_translation: Rabbi Tanhum bar Hanilai said: At the time when Hananiah, Mishael, and Azariah emerged from the fiery furnace, all the nations of the world came and clapped their hands on the cheeks of the Israelites, and said to them, "You have such a God, and you bow down to an image!" They opened and said to them, "The Lord is righteousness, and we are ashamed."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן מַאי דִּכְתִיב אָמַרְתִּי אֶעֱלֶה בְתָמָר אֹחֲזָה בְּסַנְסִנָּיו אָמַרְתִּי אַעֲלֶה בְּתָמָר  אֵלּוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל וְעַכְשָׁיו לֹא עָלָה בְּיָדִי אֶלָּא סַנְסַן אֶחָד שֶׁל חֲנַנְיָה מִישָׁאֵל וַעֲזַרְיָה
human_translation: Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani says Rabbi Yonatan says What which is written: “I said: I will climb into the palm tree; I will grasp its boughs” “I said: I will climb into the palm tree”; this is the Jewish people, And now I have succeeded in My hand only one bough of Hananiah, Mishael, and Azariah,
llm_translation: Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said in the name of Rabbi Yonatan: What is the meaning of what is written, "I will climb the palm tree and take hold of its branches"? I said, "I will climb the palm tree" - this refers to the people of Israel. But now it has not come into my hands except for one branch of Chananya, Mishael, and Azariah.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מַאי דִּכְתִיב רָאִיתִי הַלַּיְלָה וְהִנֵּה אִישׁ רֹכֵב עַל סוּס אָדֹם וְהוּא עֹמֵד בֵּין הַהֲדַסִּים אֲשֶׁר בַּמְּצֻלָה [וְגוֹ'] מַאי רָאִיתִי הַלַּיְלָה בִּיקֵּשׁ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לַהֲפוֹךְ אֶת כָּל הָעוֹלָם כּוּלּוֹ לְלַיְלָה וְהִנֵּה אִישׁ רֶכֶב אֵין אִישׁ אֶלָּא הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ה' אִישׁ מִלְחָמָה ה' שְׁמוֹ עַל סוּס אָדֹם בִּיקֵּשׁ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לַהֲפוֹךְ אֶת הָעוֹלָם כּוּלּוֹ לְדָם
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: What which is written: “I saw the night, and behold, a man riding upon a red horse, and he stood among the myrtle bushes that were in the depths” What “I saw the night”? The Holy One, Blessed be He, sought to transform the entire world into night “And behold, a man riding”; “man” no but the Holy One, Blessed be He, as it is stated: “The Lord is a man of war, The Lord is His name” “Upon a red horse” the Holy One, Blessed be He, sought to transform the whole world into blood.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: What is the meaning of what is written, "I saw at night, and behold, a man riding on a red horse, and he was standing among the myrtle trees in the valley" (Zechariah 1:8)? What did I see at night? The Holy One, blessed be He, sought to turn the entire world into night, and behold, a man riding – there is no man but the Holy One, blessed be He, as it is stated, "Hashem is a man of war, Hashem is His name" (Exodus 15:3). The Holy One, blessed be He, sought to turn the entire world into blood.

hebrew_text: כֵּיוָן שֶׁנִּסְתַּכֵּל בַּחֲנַנְיָה מִישָׁאֵל וַעֲזַרְיָה נִתְקָרְרָה דַּעְתּוֹ שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וְהוּא עֹמֵד בֵּין הַהֲדַסִּים אֲשֶׁר בַּמְּצֻלָה וְאֵין הֲדַסִּים אֶלָּא צַדִּיקִים שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וַיְהִי אֹמֵן אֶת הֲדַסָּה וְאֵין מְצוּלָה אֶלָּא בָּבֶל שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר הָאֹמֵר לַצּוּלָה חֳרָבִי וְנַהֲרֹתַיִךְ אוֹבִישׁ מִיָּד מְלֵאִים רוֹגֶז נַעֲשִׂים שְׂרוּקִּים וַאֲדוּמִּים נַעֲשׂוּ לְבָנִים אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ סוּסְיָא חִיוָּרָא מְעַלֵּי לְחֶלְמָא
human_translation: Once He looked at Hananiah, Mishael, and Azariah He was placated, as it is stated: “And he stood among the myrtle bushes [ hadassim ] that were in the depths [ bametzula ].” And hadassim no but the righteous, as it is stated: “And he raised Hadassah, And metzula no but Babylonia, as it is stated “That says to the deep [ latzula ]: Be dry, and I will dry up your rivers” Immediately filled with anger became gray, and red became white. Rav Pappa says: Conclude from it a white horse is a good for dream,
llm_translation: Since he gazed at Chananya, Mishael, and Azariah, his mind became clear, as it is stated, "And he was standing among the myrtle trees in the glen" (Zechariah 1:8). And myrtle trees are none other than the righteous, as it is stated, "And he was faithful to Hadassah" (Esther 2:7). And the glen is none other than Babylon, as it is stated, "Who says to the deep, 'Be dry, and I will dry up your rivers'" (Isaiah 44:27). Anger is turned into joy, chains into freedom. Rav Papa said: "Learn from it that the reddish horses ascend to the dream."

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן לְהֵיכָא אֲזַלוּ אָמַר רַב בְּעַיִן [הָרָע] מֵתוּ וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר בְּרוֹק טָבְעוּ וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר עָלוּ לְאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל וְנָשְׂאוּ נָשִׁים וְהוֹלִידוּ בָּנִים וּבָנוֹת
human_translation: And the Sages, where did they go Rav says: They died of the evil eye, And Shmuel says: They drowned in the spittle And Rabbi Yoḥanan says: They ascended to Eretz Yisrael and married women and fathered sons and daughters.
llm_translation: The sages went to where the evil eye said Rav, they died; and Shmuel said, they drowned; and Rabbi Yochanan said, they went up to the land of Israel, married women, and bore sons and daughters.

hebrew_text: כְּתַנָּאֵי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר בְּעַיִן [הָרָע] מֵתוּ רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר בְּרוֹק טָבְעוּ וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים עָלוּ לְאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל וְנָשְׂאוּ נָשִׁים וְהוֹלִידוּ בָּנִים וּבָנוֹת שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר שְׁמַע נָא יְהוֹשֻׁעַ הַכֹּהֵן הַגָּדוֹל אַתָּה וְרֵעֶיךָ הַיֹּשְׁבִים לְפָנֶיךָ כִּי אַנְשֵׁי מוֹפֵת הֵמָּה אֵיזוֹ הֵם אֲנָשִׁים שֶׁנַּעֲשָׂה לָהֶן מוֹפֵת  הֱוֵי אוֹמֵר זֶה חֲנַנְיָה מִישָׁאֵל וַעֲזַרְיָה
human_translation: parallel to tanna’im . Rabbi Eliezer says: They died of the evil eye. Rabbi Yehoshua says: They drowned in the spittle. And the Rabbis say: They ascended to Eretz Yisrael and married women and fathered sons and daughters, as it is stated: “Hear now, Joshua the High Priest, you and your fellows who sit before you, for they are men of wonder” Who are the people who had a wonder performed for them You must say that Hananiah, Mishael, and Azariah.
llm_translation: The scholars of the school of Rabbi Eliezer say: "In the evil eye they died." Rabbi Yehoshua says: "In a cistern they drowned." And the Sages say: "They ascended to the Land of Israel, married women, and bore sons and daughters," as it is stated, "Listen now, Joshua the High Priest, you and your companions who sit before you, for they are men of a sign. Who are these men for whom a sign was made? You must say, 'These are Hananiah, Mishael, and Azariah.'"

hebrew_text: וְדָנִיֵּאל לְהֵיכָן אֲזַל אֲמַר רַב לְמִיכְרֵא נַהֲרָא רַבָּא בִּטְבֶרְיָא וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר לְאֵתוֹיֵי בִּיזְרָא דְאַסְפַּסְתָּא וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר לְאֵתוֹיֵי חֲזִירֵי דַּאֲלֶכְּסַנְדְּרִיָּא שֶׁל מִצְרַיִם אִינִי וְהָתַנְיָא תּוֹדוֹס הָרוֹפֵא אָמַר אֵין פָּרָה וַחֲזִירָה יוֹצֵא מֵאֲלֶכְּסַנְדְּרִיָּא שֶׁל מִצְרַיִם שֶׁאֵין חוֹתְכִין הָאֵם שֶׁלָּהּ בִּשְׁבִיל שֶׁלֹּא תֵּלֵד זוּטְרֵי אַיְיתִי בְּלָא דַּעְתַּיְיהוּ
human_translation: And where did Daniel go? Rav says: to dig the great river in Tiberias. And Shmuel says: to bring alfalfa seed And Rabbi Yoḥanan says: to bring the pigs of Alexandria of Egypt. Is that so But isn’t it taught Theodosius the doctor says: No cow or sow emerges from Alexandria of Egypt whose womb is not severed so that it will not give birth? small he brought without the knowledge of
llm_translation: Daniel, where did he go? Rav said to the market of Nahar Pappa in Tiberias, and Shmuel said to the gathering place of Aspastya, and Rabbi Yochanan said to the gatherings of the pigs of Alexandria in Egypt. And it was taught: Todus the doctor said, "A cow and a pig do not come out of the pigs of Alexandria in Egypt, for they do not cut off their mother's womb so that she will not give birth to offspring." They brought it without their knowledge.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן שְׁלֹשָׁה הָיוּ בְּאוֹתָהּ עֵצָה הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא וְדָנִיֵּאל וּנְבוּכַדְנֶצַּר הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא אֲמַר נֵיזִיל דָּנִיֵּאל מֵהָכָא דְּלָא לֵימְרוּ בִּזְכוּתֵיהּ אִיתַּנְצוּל
human_translation: The Sages taught: Three were in that plan The Holy One, Blessed be He; Daniel; and Nebuchadnezzar. The Holy One, Blessed be He, said: Let Daniel go from here, so that would not say were delivered due to the virtue of
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: Three were in that council, the Holy One, blessed be He, and Daniel, and Nebuchadnezzar, the Holy One, blessed be He. He said, "Let Daniel go from here so that they do not say that he was saved by his own merit."

hebrew_text: וְדָנִיֵּאל אֲמַר אֵיזִיל מֵהָכָא דְּלָא לִיקַיַּים בִּי 'פְּסִילֵי אֱלֹהֵיהֶם תִּשְׂרְפוּן בָּאֵשׁ'
human_translation: And Daniel said I will go from here so will not be fulfilled in my “The graven images of their gods shall you burn with fire”
llm_translation: Daniel said: "I will go from here so that I will not be liable for 'the idols of their gods you shall burn with fire.'"

hebrew_text: וּנְבוּכַדְנֶצַּר אֲמַר יֵזִיל דָּנִיאֵל מֵהָכָא דְּלָא לֵימְרוּ 'קַלְיֵיהּ לֶאֱלָהֵיהּ בְּנוּרָא' וּמִנַּיִין דִּסְגִיד לֵיהּ  דִּכְתִיב בֵּאדַיִן מַלְכָּא נְבוּכַדְנֶצַּר נְפַל עַל אַנְפּוֹהִי וּלְדָנִיֵּאל סְגִד וְגוֹ'
human_translation: And Nebuchadnezzar said: Daniel should go from here so that will not say: burned his god in fire. And from where that worshipped as it is written: “Then the king Nebuchadnezzar fell upon his face and worshipped Daniel
llm_translation: And Nebuchadnezzar said, "Let Daniel go from here, so that they will not say, 'He worships his God with fire.' And from where did he learn to worship him? As it is written, 'Then King Nebuchadnezzar fell upon his face and worshipped Daniel.'"

hebrew_text: כֹּה אָמַר ה' צְבָאוֹת אֱלֹהֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל אֶל אַחְאָב בֶּן קוֹלָיָה וְאֶל צִדְקִיָּהוּ בֶן מַעֲשֵׂיָה הַנִּבְּאִים לָכֶם בִּשְׁמִי לַשָּׁקֶר וְגוֹ' וּכְתִיב וְלָקַח מֵהֶם קְלָלָה לְכֹל גָּלוּת יְהוּדָה אֲשֶׁר בְּבָבֶל לֵאמֹר יְשִׂימְךָ ה' כְּצִדְקִיָּהוּ וּכְאֶחָאב אֲשֶׁר קָלָם מֶלֶךְ בָּבֶל בָּאֵשׁ אֲשֶׁר שְׂרָפָם לֹא נֶאֱמַר אֶלָּא אֲשֶׁר קָלָם אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַי מְלַמֵּד שֶׁעֲשָׂאָן כִּקְלָיוֹת
human_translation: “So says the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel, concerning Ahab, son of Kolaiah, and of Zedekiah, son of Maaseiah, who prophesy to you a lie in My name: And it is written: “And of them shall be taken a curse by all the captivity of Judea, who are in Babylonia, saying: May the Lord make you like Zedekiah and like Ahab, whom the king of Babylonia toasted in the fire” is not stated: Whom burned, but “whom toasted.” Rabbi Yoḥanan said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai: This teaches that he rendered them like toasted wheat,
llm_translation: So said the Lord of Hosts, the God of Israel, to Ahab son of Kolaiah and to Zedekiah son of Maaseiah, the prophets who prophesy lies to you in My name, and it is written, "And I will take from them a curse for all the captivity of Judah that are in Babylon, saying, 'The Lord make you like Zedekiah and like Ahab, whom the king of Babylon roasted in the fire.'" It is not said, "whom the king of Babylon burned," but rather, "whom the king roasted." Rabbi Yochanan said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai: This teaches that they made them like roasted fish.

hebrew_text: יַעַן אֲשֶׁר עָשׂוּ נְבָלָה בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל וַיְנַאֲפוּ אֶת נְשֵׁי רֵעֵיהֶם מַאי עֲבוּד אֲזוּל לְגַבֵּי בְּרַתֵּיה דִּנְבוּכַדְנֶצַּר אַחְאָב אֲמַר לַהּ כֹּה אָמַר ה' הִשָּׁמֵיעִי אֶל צִדְקִיָּה וְצִדְקִיָּה אֱמֹר כֹּה אָמַר ה' הִשָּׁמֵיעִי אֶל אַחְאָב אֲזַלָה וַאֲמַרָה לֵיהּ לַאֲבוּהּ אֲמַר לַהּ אֱלֹהֵיהֶם שֶׁל אֵלּוּ שׂוֹנֵא זִימָּה הוּא כִּי אָתוּ לְגַבָּךְ שַׁדְּרִינְהוּ לְגַבַּאי
human_translation: “Because they have committed baseness in Israel, and have committed adultery with the wives of their neighbors” What did they do? They went to the daughter of Nebuchadnezzar. Ahab said to her: So says the Lord: Submit to Zedekiah And Zedekiah said So says the Lord: Submit to Ahab She went and said to her father said to her: The God of these abhors lewdness, When they come to you, send them to me.
llm_translation: Because they committed a disgrace in Israel and they committed adultery with the wives of their neighbors, what is the service? Go to the daughter of the governor of Nebuchadnezzar, Ahab said to her, "Thus says the Lord, 'Proclaim to Zedekiah, and Zedekiah should say, "Thus says the Lord, 'Proclaim to Ahab, go and say to him, 'Your gods, the gods of these, hate immorality, for they have come against you, send them to the ravine.'"

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתוֹ לְגַבַּהּ שַׁדַּרְתַּנְהוּ לְגַבֵּי אֲבוּהָ אֲמַר לְהוּ מַאן אֲמַר לְכוֹן אֲמַרוּ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא וְהָא חֲנַנְיָה מִישָׁאֵל וַעֲזַרְיָה שְׁאֵלְתִּינְהוּ וַאֲמַרוּ לִי אָסוּר אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ אֲנַן נָמֵי נְבִיאֵי כְּווֹתַיְיהוּ לְדִידְהוּ לָא אֲמַר לְהוּ לְדִידַן אֲמַר לַן אֲמַר לְהוּ אֲנָא בָּעֵינָא דְּאֶיבְדְּקִינְכוּ כִּי הֵיכִי דִּבְדַקְתִּינְהוּ לַחֲנַנְיָה מִישָׁאֵל וַעֲזַרְיָה
human_translation: When they came to her, she sent them to her father. said to them: Who told you They said: the Holy One, Blessed be He. But haven’t I have asked Hananiah, Mishael, and Azariah and they said to me: It is prohibited? They said to him: We too are prophets like they are. did not say to them; He said to us. said to them: I wish to put you to the test just as I put Hananiah, Mishael, and Azariah to the test.
llm_translation: When they came to elevate him, they sent him to his father. He said to them, "Who said to you to do this?" They said, "The Holy One, blessed be He." But Hananiah, Mishael, and Azariah I asked, and they said to me it is forbidden. He said to them, "We too are prophets like them, for ourselves they did not say it is forbidden." He said to them, "I want to test you, how did you test Hananiah, Mishael, and Azariah."

hebrew_text: אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ אִינּוּן תְּלָתָא הֲווֹ וַאֲנַן תְּרֵין אֲמַר לְהוּ בְּחַרוּ לְכוֹן מַאן דְּבָעֵיתוּ בַּהֲדַיְיכוּ אֲמַרוּ יְהוֹשֻׁעַ כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל סָבְרִי לֵיתֵי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ דִּנְפִישׁ זְכוּתֵיהּ וּמַגְּנָא עֲלַן
human_translation: said to They were three and we are two, said to them: Choose for yourselves whomever you wish, with you. They said Joshua the High Priest. they thought: Let Joshua come since his merit is great and it will protect us.
llm_translation: They said to him: "They are three, and we are two." He said to them: "Choose for yourselves. Whoever wants to come with me, let him come." They said: "Yehoshua the High Priest thinks that his merit is greater and protects us."

hebrew_text: אַחְתְיוּהּ שְׁדִינְהוּ אִינְהוּ אִיקְּלוֹ יְהוֹשֻׁעַ כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל אִיחֲרֻךְ אִיחֲרוֹכֵי מָאנֵיהּ שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וַיַּרְאֵנִי אֶת יְהוֹשֻׁעַ הַכֹּהֵן הַגָּדוֹל עֹמֵד לִפְנֵי מַלְאַךְ ה' וְגוֹ' וּכְתִיב וַיֹּאמֶר ה' אֶל הַשָּׂטָן יִגְעַר ה' בְּךָ וְגוֹ'
human_translation: They took them down cast them They were burned, Joshua the High Priest, his garments were singed, as it is stated: “And He showed me Joshua the High Priest, standing before the angel of the Lord, And it is written: “And the Lord said to Satan, the Lord shall rebuke you,
llm_translation: They argued with him, they said to him, "Joshua the high priest, you have delayed, you have delayed." What did he answer them? As it is said, "And the Lord showed me Joshua the high priest standing before the angel of the Lord..." And it is written, "And the Lord said to Satan, 'The Lord rebuke you...'"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ יָדַעְנָא דְּצַדִּיקָא אַתְּ אֶלָּא מַאי טַעְמָא אַהְנְיָא בָּךְ פּוּרְתָּא נוּרָא חֲנַנְיָה מִישָׁאֵל וַעֲזַרְיָה לָא אַהְנְיָא בְּהוּ כְּלָל אֲמַר לֵיהּ אִינְהוּ תְּלָתָא הֲווֹ וַאֲנָא חַד אָמַר לֵיהּ וְהָא אַבְרָהָם יָחִיד הֲוָה הָתָם לָא הֲווֹ רְשָׁעִים בַּהֲדֵיהּ וְלָא אִתְיְהִיב רְשׁוּתָא לְנוּרָא הָכָא הֲווֹ רְשָׁעִים בַּהֲדַי וְאִתְיְהִיב רְשׁוּתָא לְנוּרָא הַיְינוּ דְּאָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי תְּרֵי אוּדֵי יַבִּישֵׁי וְחַד רַטִּיבָא (אוֹקְדַן) [אוֹקְדוּהּ] יַבִּישֵׁי לְרַטִּיבָא
human_translation: said to I know you are righteous but what is the reason the fire was slightly effective concerning you, Hananiah, Mishael, and Azariah was not effective concerning them at all, said to him: They were three and I am one. said to him: But wasn’t Abraham one There, there were no wicked people with him, and license was not given to the fire. Here, there were wicked with me, and license was given to the fire. this that people say: two dry firebrands and one moist one the dry burn the moist one.
llm_translation: He said to him: "I know that you are righteous, but what is the reason that the fiery furnace was effective for you, Hananiah, Mishael, and Azariah, but was not effective for them as a whole?" He said to him: "They were three, and I was one." He said to him: "But Abraham was alone there, and the wicked were not effective against him, and He did not give authority to the fiery furnace over him." Here, the wicked were effective against them, and He gave authority to the fiery furnace over them. This is like what people say: Two dry logs will not ignite, but one moist log will ignite the dry ones.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא אִיעֲנַשׁ אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא שֶׁהָיוּ בָּנָיו נוֹשְׂאִין נָשִׁים שֶׁאֵינָן הֲגוּנוֹת לִכְהוּנָּה וְלֹא מִיחָה בָּהֶן שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וִיהוֹשֻׁעַ הָיָה לָבֻשׁ בְּגָדִים צוֹאִים וְכִי דַרְכּוֹ שֶׁל יְהוֹשֻׁעַ לִלְבּוֹשׁ בְּגָדִים צוֹאִים אֶלָּא מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהָיוּ בָּנָיו נוֹשְׂאִים נָשִׁים שֶׁאֵינָן הֲגוּנוֹת לִכְהוּנָּה וְלֹא מִיחָה בָּהֶן
human_translation: What is the reason was punished Rav Pappa says: that his sons would marry women who were not fit for priesthood, and he did not reprimand them, as it is stated: “And Joshua was clothed in filthy garments, And was it the manner of Joshua to wear filthy garments? Rather teaches that his sons would marry women who were not fit for priesthood, and he did not reprimand them.
llm_translation: What is the reason that he was punished? Rav Papa said: Because his sons married women who were not fitting for the priesthood, and he did not protest against them, as it is stated: "And Joshua was clothed in filthy garments" (Zechariah 3:3). Is it the way of Joshua to wear filthy garments? Rather, it teaches that his sons married women who were not fitting for the priesthood, and he did not protest against them.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי תַּנְחוּם דָּרַשׁ בַּר קַפָּרָא בְּצִיפּוֹרִי מַאי דִּכְתִיב שֵׁשׁ הַשְּׂעֹרִים הָאֵלֶּה נָתַן לִי מַאי שֵׁשׁ הַשְּׂעֹרִים אִילֵּימָא שֵׁשׁ שְׂעוֹרִים מַמָּשׁ וְכִי דַרְכּוֹ שֶׁל בּוֹעַז לִיתֵּן מַתָּנָה שֵׁשׁ שְׂעוֹרִים
human_translation: Rabbi Tanḥum says bar Kappara taught in Tzippori: What which is written “These six barley he gave me” What “six barley”? If we say six actual barley, is it the manner of Boaz to give gift of six barley?
llm_translation: Rabbi Tanhum said, Bar Kappara expounded in Tsippori: What is the meaning of what is written, "These six measures of barley he gave me"? What are these six measures of barley? Perhaps six actual barley grains? Is it the way of Boaz to give a gift of six barley grains?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא שֵׁשׁ סְאִין
human_translation: Rather, six se’a .
llm_translation: Rather, six se'ah.

hebrew_text: וְכִי דַּרְכָּהּ שֶׁל אִשָּׁה לִיטּוֹל שֵׁשׁ סְאִין אֶלָּא רֶמֶז [ רָמַז] לָהּ שֶׁעֲתִידִין שִׁשָּׁה בָּנִים לָצֵאת מִמֶּנָּה שֶׁמִּתְבָּרְכִין בְּשֵׁשׁ [שֵׁשׁ] בְּרָכוֹת וְאֵלּוּ הֵן דָּוִד וּמָשִׁיחַ דָּנִיֵּאל חֲנַנְיָה מִישָׁאֵל וַעֲזַרְיָה דָּוִד דִּכְתִיב וַיַּעַן אֶחָד מֵהַנְּעָרִים וַיֹּאמֶר הִנֵּה רָאִיתִי בֵּן לְיִשַׁי בֵּית הַלַּחְמִי יֹדֵעַ נַגֵּן וְגִבּוֹר חַיִל וְאִישׁ מִלְחָמָה וּנְבוֹן דָּבָר וְאִישׁ תֹּאַר וַה' עִמּוֹ וְגוֹ'
human_translation: And is the manner of a woman to take six se’a Rather, alluded to that six descendants are destined to emerge from her who would each be blessed with six blessings, and these are they: David, and Messiah, Daniel, Hananiah, Mishael, and Azariah. David as it is written: “And one of the servants answered and said: Behold, I have seen a son of Yishai of the house of Bethlehem who knows to play, and is a fine warrior, and a man of war, and prudent in speech, and a comely man, and the Lord is with him”
llm_translation: And when is it the way of a woman to conceive six se'ahs, but a hint hinted to her that six sons are destined to come forth from her, who will be blessed with six six blessings, and these are David and the Messiah, Daniel, Hananiah, Mishael, and Azariah. David, as it is written, "And one of the young men answered and said, 'Behold, I have seen a son of Jesse the Bethlehemite, who is skillful in playing, a mighty man of valor, a man of war, prudent in speech, and a comely person, and the Lord is with him,' and so forth."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב כׇּל הַפָּסוּק הַזֶּה לֹא אֲמָרוֹ דּוֹאֵג אֶלָּא בְּלָשׁוֹן הָרָע יֹדֵעַ נַגֵּן שֶׁיּוֹדֵעַ לִישָּׁאֵל גִּבּוֹר שֶׁיּוֹדֵעַ לְהָשִׁיב אִישׁ מִלְחָמָה שֶׁיּוֹדֵעַ לִישָּׂא וְלִיתֵּן בְּמִלְחַמְתָּהּ שֶׁל תּוֹרָה אִישׁ תֹּאַר שֶׁמַּרְאֶה פָּנִים בַּהֲלָכָה וּנְבוֹן דָּבָר שֶׁמֵּבִין דָּבָר מִתּוֹךְ דָּבָר וַה' עִמּוֹ שֶׁהֲלָכָה כְּמוֹתוֹ בְּכׇל מָקוֹם
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Rav says: Doeg stated this entire verse only as malicious speech, “Who knows how to play” that he knows to ask warrior” that he knows to answer “A man of war,” that he knows to negotiate in the battle Torah. “A comely man” who displays understanding in halakha “And prudent in speech [ davar ]” that he infers matter [ davar ] from matter. “And the Lord is with him” that the halakha is in accordance with his in every area
llm_translation: And Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: "This entire verse was not said concerning Doeg, but in the language of evil. One who knows how to play the harp, one who knows to return, a man of war who knows to lift and to give in her battle, a man of form who appears in halacha, and understanding in speech, who understands a matter from within a matter, and God is with him, that the halacha is like his in every place."

hebrew_text: בְּכוּלְּהוּ אֲמַר לְהוּ יְהוֹנָתָן בְּנִי כָּמוֹהוּ כֵּיוָן דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ וַה' עִמּוֹ מִילְּתָא דִּבְדִידֵיהּ נָמֵי לָא הֲוָה בֵּיהּ חֲלַשׁ דַּעְתֵּיהּ וְאִיקַּנִּי בֵּיהּ דִּבְשָׁאוּל כְּתִיב וּבְכֹל אֲשֶׁר יִפְנֶה יַרְשִׁיעַ וּבְדָוִד כְּתִיב וּבְכֹל אֲשֶׁר יִפְנֶה יַצְלִיחַ
human_translation: In all of said to My son Jonathan is his equal. Once said to “And the Lord is with him,” a matter that did not even to himself, he was offended and grew jealous As with regard to Saul it is written: “And wherever he turned he put them to the worse” and with regard to David it is written: And wherever he turns he does prosper.
llm_translation: In all, said to them Yehonatan my son like him, since he said to him "and Hashem is with him," his own matter also was not weak in him, and he found in him the likeness of Shaul, as it is written about Shaul, "and in all that he turns to, he will succeed," and about David it is written, "and in all that he turns to, he will prosper."

hebrew_text: מְנָלַן דְּדוֹאֵג הֲוָה כְּתִיב הָכָא וַיַּעַן אֶחָד מֵהַנְּעָרִים  מְיוּחָד שֶׁבַּנְּעָרִים וּכְתִיב הָתָם וְשָׁם אִישׁ מֵעַבְדֵי שָׁאוּל בַּיּוֹם הַהוּא נֶעְצָר לִפְנֵי ה' וּשְׁמוֹ דֹּאֵג הָאֲדֹמִי אַבִּיר הָרֹעִים אֲשֶׁר לְשָׁאוּל
human_translation: From where do we that was Doeg it is written here: “And one [ eḥad ] of the servants answered,” the most notable [ meyuḥad ] of the servants. And it is written there: “And a certain man of the servants of Saul was there that day, detained before the Lord, and his name was Doeg the Edomite, the chief of the herdsmen that belonged to Saul”
llm_translation: From where is it derived that Doeg was written here? And it is written there, "And there was one of the young men who was distinguished among the young men." And it is written there, "And there was a man of the servants of Saul on that day, detained before the Lord, and his name was Doeg the Edomite, the chief of the shepherds who belonged to Saul."

hebrew_text: מָשִׁיחַ דִּכְתִיב וְנָחָה עָלָיו רוּחַ ה' רוּחַ חׇכְמָה וּבִינָה רוּחַ עֵצָה וּגְבוּרָה רוּחַ דַּעַת וְיִרְאַת ה' וְגוֹ' וּכְתִיב וַהֲרִיחוֹ בְּיִרְאַת ה'
human_translation: Messiah as it is written: “And the spirit of the Lord shall rest upon him, the spirit of wisdom and understanding, the spirit of counsel and might, the spirit of knowledge and of the fear of the Lord” and it is written: “And his delight [ vahariḥo ] shall be the fear of the Lord,
llm_translation: The Messiah, as it is written: "And the spirit of the Lord shall rest upon him, the spirit of wisdom and understanding, the spirit of counsel and might, the spirit of knowledge and the fear of the Lord." And it is written: "And he shall delight in the fear of the Lord."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֲלֶכְּסַנְדְּרִי מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהִטְעִינוֹ מִצְוֹת וְיִסּוּרִין כְּרֵיחַיִים רָבָא אָמַר דְּמוֹרַח וְדָאֵין דִּכְתִיב וְלֹא לְמַרְאֵה עֵינָיו יִשְׁפּוֹט וְשָׁפַט בְּצֶדֶק דַּלִּים וְהוֹכִיחַ בְּמִישׁוֹר לְעַנְוֵי אָרֶץ
human_translation: Rabbi Alexandri says teaches that burdened with mitzvot and afflictions like millstones [ reiḥayim ]. Rava says that smell [ demoraḥ ] and judge as it is written: “And he shall neither judge after the sight of [ lemareh ] his eyes, and with righteousness shall he judge the poor, and decide equity for the meek of the earth”
llm_translation: Rabbi Alexandri said: It teaches that one who fulfills commandments and endures suffering, it is as pleasing as the scent of Lebanon. Rava said: It is repulsive and not, as it is written, "He shall not judge by what his eyes see, or decide by what his ears hear; but with righteousness he shall judge the poor, and decide with equity for the meek of the earth."

hebrew_text: בַּר כּוֹזֵיבָא מְלַךְ תַּרְתֵּין שְׁנִין וּפַלְגָא אֲמַר לְהוּ לְרַבָּנַן אֲנָא מָשִׁיחַ אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ בְּמָשִׁיחַ כְּתִיב דְּמוֹרַח וְדָאֵין נֶחְזֵי אֲנַן אִי מוֹרַח וְדָאֵין כֵּיוָן דְּחַזְיוּהּ דְּלָא מוֹרַח וְדָאֵין קַטְלוּהּ
human_translation: Bar Koziva, ruled for two and a half years. He said to the Sages: I am Messiah. They said to him: With regard to the Messiah it is written that he smell and judge, let us see ourselves whether he, smell and judge. Once they saw that not smell and judge, killed him.
llm_translation: Bar Koziba reigned for two years and a half. He said to the Rabbis, "I am the Messiah." They said to him, "In the Messiah it is written that he is slow and lowly. Let us see if you are slow and lowly." Once they saw that he was not slow and lowly, they killed him.

hebrew_text: דָּנִיֵּאל חֲנַנְיָה מִישָׁאֵל וַעֲזַרְיָה דִּכְתִיב בְּהוּ אֲשֶׁר אֵין בָּהֶם כׇּל מְאוּם וְטוֹבֵי מַרְאֶה וּמַשְׂכִּילִים בְּכׇל חׇכְמָה וְיֹדְעֵי דַעַת וּמְבִינֵי מַדָּע וַאֲשֶׁר כֹּחַ בָּהֶם לַעֲמֹד בְּהֵיכַל הַמֶּלֶךְ וּלְלַמְּדָם סֵפֶר וּלְשׁוֹן כַּשְׂדִּים
human_translation: Daniel, Hananiah, Mishael, and Azariah, as it is written in their in whom was found no blemish, and well favored, and skillful in all wisdom, and discerning in knowledge, and perceptive in understanding, and who had strength in them to stand in the king’s palace, and whom they might teach the learning and the tongue of the Chaldeans”
llm_translation: Daniel, Hananiah, Mishael, and Azariah, as it is written about them, "who had no blemish, and were of good appearance and skillful in all wisdom, endowed with knowledge, understanding learning, and competent to stand in the king's palace, and to teach them the literature and language of the Chaldeans."

hebrew_text: מַאי אֲשֶׁר אֵין בָּהֶם כׇּל מוּם אָמַר רַבִּי חָמָא בַּר חֲנַנְיָא אֲפִילּוּ כְּרִיבְדָּא דְכוּסִילְתָּא לָא הֲוָה בְּהוּ מַאי וַאֲשֶׁר כֹּחַ בָּהֶם לַעֲמֹד בְּהֵיכַל הַמֶּלֶךְ אָמַר רַבִּי חָמָא בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהָיוּ אוֹנְסִין אֶת עַצְמָן מִן הַשְּׂחוֹק וּמִן הַשִּׂיחָה וּמִן הַשֵּׁינָה וּמַעֲמִידִין עַל עַצְמָן בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁנִּצְרָכִין לְנִקְבֵיהֶם מִפְּנֵי אֵימַת מַלְכוּת
human_translation: What “in whom was found no blemish”? Rabbi Ḥama bar Ḥanina says: Even like the wound after bloodletting was not in them. What “and who had strength in them to stand in the king’s place”? Rabbi Ḥama, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, says: teaches that they would force themselves from laughter, and from conversation, and from sleep, and would restrain themselves when they urge their orifices, due to fear of the monarchy.
llm_translation: What is "that they have no blemish"? Rabbi Ḥama son of Ḥananya said: Even like the ramp of the palace of Susa was not in them. What is "and that they have strength to stand in the king's palace"? Rabbi Ḥama son of Rabbi Ḥanina said: This teaches that they would force themselves from laughter, idle talk, and sleep, and would stand on their own at the time when they needed to pierce their foreskins because of fear of the kingdom.

hebrew_text: וַיְהִי בָהֶם מִבְּנֵי יְהוּדָה דָּנִיֵּאל חֲנַנְיָה מִישָׁאֵל וַעֲזַרְיָה אָמַר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר כּוּלָּן מִבְּנֵי יְהוּדָה הֵם וְרַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר דָּנִיאֵל מִבְּנֵי יְהוּדָה חֲנַנְיָה מִישָׁאֵל וַעֲזַרְיָה מִשְּׁאָר שְׁבָטִים
human_translation: “Now among these were, of the descendants of Judah: Daniel, Hananiah, Mishael, and Azariah” Rabbi Eliezer says: They were all of the descendants of Judah. And Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani says: Daniel was of the descendants of Judah, and Hananiah, Mishael, and Azariah were of other tribes.
llm_translation: And it was among them from the sons of Judah: Daniel, Hananiah, Mishael, and Azariah. Rabbi Eliezer said: All of them are from the sons of Judah. And Rabbi Samuel bar Nahmani said: Daniel is from the sons of Judah, Hananiah, Mishael, and Azariah are from the rest of the tribes.

hebrew_text: וּמִבָּנֶיךָ אֲשֶׁר יֵצְאוּ מִמְּךָ אֲשֶׁר תּוֹלִיד יִקָּחוּ וְהָיוּ סָרִיסִים בְּהֵיכַל מֶלֶךְ בָּבֶל מַאי סָרִיסִים רַב אָמַר סָרִיסִים מַמָּשׁ וְרַבִּי חֲנִינָא אָמַר שֶׁנִּסְתָּרְסָה עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה בִּימֵיהֶם
human_translation: “And of your sons that shall issue from you, they shall be taken away; and they shall be officers [ sarisim ] in the palace of the king of Babylonia” What sarisim ? Rav says: literally eunuchs, And Rabbi Ḥanina says: that idol worship was emasculated during their lifetime,
llm_translation: And from your offspring that will come out from you, whom you will father, they will be taken and they will be eunuchs in the palace of the king of Babylon. What is meant by "eunuchs"? Rav said: literal eunuchs. And Rabbi Chanina said: that foreign worship was hidden in their days.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר שֶׁנִּסְתָּרְסָה עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה בִּימֵיהֶם  הַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב וַחֲבָל לָא אִיתַי בְּהוֹן אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר סָרִיסִים מַמָּשׁ מַאי וַחֲבָל לָא אִיתַי בְּהוֹן חַבְלָא דְּנוּרָא וְהָכְתִיב וְרֵיחַ נוּר לָא עֲדָת בְּהוֹן לָא חַבְלָא וְלָא רֵיחָא
human_translation: Granted, according to the one who says that idol worship was emasculated during their lifetime, that is as it is written: “And they have no hurt” But according to the one who says literally eunuchs, what is “And they have no hurt”? hurt from the fire But isn’t it written: “Nor had the odor of fire passed over them” neither hurt nor odor
llm_translation: In truth, according to the one who says that idolatry was concealed in their days, that is what is written, "And a rope does not come upon them." But according to the one who says they were actual eunuchs, what is "And a rope does not come upon them"? It is the rope of fire. And it is written, "And the smell of fire did not cling to them," not a rope and not a smell.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר שֶׁנִּסְתָּרְסָה עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה בִּימֵיהֶם  הַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב כֹּה אָמַר ה' לַסָּרִיסִים אֲשֶׁר יִשְׁמְרוּ אֶת שַׁבְּתֹתַי וְגוֹ' אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר סָרִיסִים מַמָּשׁ מִשְׁתַּעֵי קְרָא בִּגְנוּתָא דְּצַדִּיקֵי הָא וְהָא הֲוָה בְּהוּ
human_translation: Granted, according to the one who says that idol worship was emasculated during their lifetime, that is as it is written: “For so says the Lord to the sarisim who observe My Shabbatot , But according to the one who says literally eunuchs, the verse speak in denigration of the righteous? this, and that, were concerning them.
llm_translation: In peace, according to the one who says that foreign worship was concealed in their days, as it is written, "Thus said the Lord to the eunuchs who keep My Sabbaths, etc." But according to the one who says that eunuchs literally stray, the verse was in the honor of the righteous. This one and that one were in it.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר סָרִיסִים מַמָּשׁ  הַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב בְּבֵיתִי וּבְחוֹמֹתַי יָד וָשֵׁם טוֹב מִבָּנִים וּמִבָּנוֹת אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר שֶׁנִּסְתָּרְסָה עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה בִּימֵיהֶם מַאי טוֹב מִבָּנִים וּמִבָּנוֹת אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק מִבָּנִים שֶׁהָיוּ לָהֶם כְּבָר וּמֵתוּ מַאי שָׁם עוֹלָם אֶתֶּן לוֹ אֲשֶׁר לֹא יִכָּרֵת אָמַר רַבִּי תַּנְחוּם דָּרַשׁ בַּר קַפָּרָא בְּצִפּוֹרִי זֶה סֵפֶר דָּנִיֵּאל שֶׁנִּקְרָא עַל שְׁמוֹ
human_translation: Granted, according to the one who says literally eunuchs, that is as it is written in My house and within My walls a memorial better than sons and daughters: But according to the one who says that idol worship was emasculated during their lifetime, what “better than sons and daughters”? Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak says: concerning children that they already had and died, What “an everlasting name that shall not be excised”? Rabbi Tanḥum says bar Kappara taught in Tzippori: This the book of Daniel, which is called by his name.
llm_translation: In peace, according to the one who says eunuchs literally, that is as it is written, "In my house and within my walls a hand and a name better than sons and daughters." But according to the one who says that foreign worship was hidden in their days, what is the meaning of "better than sons and daughters"? Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said, "Better than sons who were already theirs and died." What is the meaning of "therefore I will give him an everlasting portion that will not be cut off"? Rabbi Tanhum bar Kapara expounded: "In the book of Daniel, which is called after his name."

hebrew_text: מִכְּדֵי כֹּל מִילֵּי דְּעֶזְרָא נְחֶמְיָה בֶּן חֲכַלְיָה אַמְרִינְהוּ וּנְחֶמְיָה בֶּן חֲכַלְיָה מַאי טַעְמָא לָא אִיקְּרִי סִיפְרָא עַל שְׁמֵיהּ אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה בַּר אַבָּא מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהֶחְזִיק טוֹבָה לְעַצְמוֹ שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר זׇכְרָה לִּי אֱלֹהַי לְטוֹבָה דָּוִד נָמֵי מֵימָר אָמַר זׇכְרֵנִי ה' בִּרְצוֹן עַמֶּךָ פׇּקְדֵנִי בִּישׁוּעָתֶךָ דָּוִד רַחֲמֵי הוּא דְּקָבָעֵי
human_translation: Now all the matters of Ezra, Nehemiah, son of Hacaliah, said them and Nehemiah, son of Hacaliah, what is the reason a book was not called by his name? Rabbi Yirmeya bar Abba says: because he took credit for himself as it is stated: “Remember me, God, for good” David also said: “Remember me, Lord, when You show favor to Your people; visit me with Your salvation” David was asking for compassion
llm_translation: From all the matters of Ezra and Nehemiah, Nehemiah son of Hacaliah said, "And Nehemiah son of Hacaliah, what is the reason that the book is not called by his name?" Rabbi Yirmiyah bar Abba said, "Because he held good for himself, as it is said, 'Remember me, my God, for good, also the words of David are saying, 'Remember me, O Lord, with the favor of Your people; visit me with Your salvation,' David is the one who established mercy."

hebrew_text: רַב יוֹסֵף אָמַר מִפְּנֵי שֶׁסִּיפֵּר בִּגְנוּתָן שֶׁל רִאשׁוֹנִים שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וְהַפַּחוֹת הָרִאשׁוֹנִים אֲשֶׁר לְפָנַי הִכְבִּידוּ עַל הָעָם וַיִּקְחוּ מֵהֶם בְּלֶחֶם וָיַיִן אַחַר כֶּסֶף שְׁקָלִים אַרְבָּעִים וְגוֹ' וְאַף עַל דָּנִיֵּאל שֶׁגָּדוֹל מִמֶּנּוּ סִיפֵּר
human_translation: Rav Yosef says: because he spoke in denigration of predecessors, as it is stated: “But the former governors who were before me placed burdens upon the people, and took from them for bread and wine beyond forty shekels And he related even about Daniel, who was greater than he
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: Because he spoke disparagingly of the elders, as it is stated, "And the younger of them said to his father, 'Father, these are the pachot, the lesser ones, who are before me, have made heavy upon the people, and they have taken from them bread and wine after forty shekels of silver, and even upon Daniel, who was greater than they, he spoke disparagingly."

hebrew_text: וּמְנָלַן דְּגָדוֹל מִמֶּנּוּ דִּכְתִיב וְרָאִיתִי אֲנִי דָנִיֵּאל לְבַדִּי אֶת הַמַּרְאָה וְהָאֲנָשִׁים אֲשֶׁר הָיוּ עִמִּי לֹא רָאוּ אֶת הַמַּרְאָה אֲבָל חֲרָדָה גְדֹלָה נָפְלָה עֲלֵיהֶם וַיִּבְרְחוּ בְּהֵחָבֵא וְהָאֲנָשִׁים אֲשֶׁר הָיוּ עִמִּי לֹא רָאוּ אֶת הַמַּרְאָה וּמַאן נִינְהוּ אֲנָשִׁים אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה וְאִיתֵּימָא רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא זֶה חַגַּי זְכַרְיָה וּמַלְאָכִי
human_translation: From where do we that greater than he as it is written: “And I, Daniel, alone saw the vision, and the men who were with me did not see the vision; but a great trembling fell upon them, and they fled to hide” “And the men who were with me did not see the vision”; and who were men? Rabbi Yirmeya, and some say Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba, says: That Haggai, Zechariah, and Malachi,
llm_translation: And from where do we know that he was greater than them, as it is written, "And I, Daniel, alone saw the vision, but the men who were with me did not see the vision; however, a great terror fell upon them, and they fled to hide themselves." And the men who were with me did not see the vision. And who are these men? Rabbi Yirmeyah said, and some say Rabbi Hiyya bar Abba: this is Haggai, Zechariah, and Malachi.

hebrew_text: אִינְהוּ עֲדִיפִי מִינֵּיהּ וְאִיהוּ עֲדִיף מִנַּיְיהוּ אִינְהוּ עֲדִיפִי מִינֵּיהּ  דְּאִינְהוּ נְבִיאֵי וְאִיהוּ לָאו נְבִיָּא וְאִיהוּ עֲדִיף מִנַּיְיהוּ  דְּאִיהוּ חֲזָא וְאִינְהוּ לָא חֲזוֹ
human_translation: were greater than and was greater than They were greater than he, as they were prophets and he was not a prophet. And he was greater than they, as he saw and they did not see
llm_translation: They are superior to him, and he is superior to them. They are superior to him because they are prophets, and he is not a prophet, yet he is superior to them because he sees, and they do not see.

hebrew_text: וְכִי מֵאַחַר דְּלָא חֲזוֹ מַאי טַעְמָא אִיבְּעוּת אַף עַל גַּב דְּאִינְהוּ לָא חֲזוֹ מִידֵּי מַזָּלַיְיהוּ חָזֵי אָמַר רָבִינָא שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ הַאי מַאן דְּמִבְּעִית אַף עַל גַּב דְּאִיהוּ לָא חָזֵי מַזָּלֵיהּ חָזֵי
human_translation: And since they did not see what is the reason they were frightened? Although they did not see their guardian angels saw Ravina said: Conclude from it this who becomes frightened although he does not see his guardian angel sees
llm_translation: And when they did not see, what is the reason? Enmity. Even though they did not see from their own, they see from their stars. Ravina said: Learn from this, whoever causes enmity, even though he does not see, his stars see.

hebrew_text: מַאי תַּקַּנְתֵּיהּ לִינְשׁוֹף מִדּוּכְתֵּיהּ אַרְבְּעָה גַּרְמִידֵי אִי נָמֵי לִיקְרֵי קְרִיַּת שְׁמַע וְאִי קָאֵי בִּמְקוֹם הַטִּנּוֹפֶת לֵימָא הָכִי עִיזָּא דְּבֵי טַבָּחָא שַׁמִּינָא מִינַּאי
human_translation: What is his remedy? Let him leap four cubits from his location Alternatively, let him recite Shema , And if he is standing in a place of filth, let him say this The goat of the slaughterhouse is fatter than I,
llm_translation: What is the benefit of sweeping from its place? Four causes: if it is in the south, it is called "Kriyat Shema," and if it is in the place of the tannery, one should say thus: "This is the goat of the butcher's house, it is a species of mine."

hebrew_text: לְםַרְבֵּה הַמִּשְׂרָה וּלְשָׁלוֹם אֵין קֵץ וְגוֹ' אָמַר רַבִּי תַּנְחוּם דָּרַשׁ בַּר קַפָּרָא בְּצִיפּוֹרִי מִפְּנֵי מָה כׇּל מֵם שֶׁבְּאֶמְצַע תֵּיבָה פָּתוּחַ וְזֶה  סָתוּם בִּיקֵּשׁ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לַעֲשׂוֹת חִזְקִיָּהוּ מָשִׁיחַ וְסַנְחֵרִיב גּוֹג וּמָגוֹג
human_translation: “That the government may be increased [ lemarbe ] and of peace there be no end, Rabbi Tanḥum says bar Kappara taught in Tzippori: Due to what is it that every mem in the middle of a word is open and this is closed? the Holy One, Blessed be He, sought to designate Hezekiah Messiah and Sennacherib Gog and Magog,
llm_translation: To increase the leadership and there is no end for peace, etc. Rabbi Tanhum said: Bar Kappara expounded in Tzipori: Why is every "mem" in the middle of a word open, and this one is closed? The Holy One, blessed be He, sought to make Hezekiah the Messiah and to destroy Gog and Magog.

hebrew_text: אָמְרָה מִדַּת הַדִּין לִפְנֵי הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם וּמָה דָּוִד מֶלֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁאָמַר כַּמָּה שִׁירוֹת וְתִשְׁבָּחוֹת לְפָנֶיךָ  לֹא עֲשִׂיתוֹ מָשִׁיחַ חִזְקִיָּה שֶׁעָשִׂיתָ לוֹ כׇּל הַנִּסִּים הַלָּלוּ וְלֹא אָמַר שִׁירָה לְפָנֶיךָ  תַּעֲשֵׂהוּ מָשִׁיחַ לְכָךְ נִסְתַּתֵּם
human_translation: The attribute of justice said before the Holy One, Blessed be He: Master of the Universe, and if David, king of Israel, who recited several songs and praises before You, You did not designate him Messiah, Hezekiah, for whom You performed all these miracles, and he did not recite praise before You, will You designate him Messiah? for that was closed,
llm_translation: The measure of justice said before the Holy One, blessed be He, Master of the world: And what did David, King of Israel, say, "How many songs and praises before You, You did not make him, Messiah Hezekiah, whom You performed all these miracles for, and he did not sing before You. Make him Messiah, therefore you were hidden."

hebrew_text: מִיָּד פָּתְחָה הָאָרֶץ וְאָמְרָה לְפָנָיו רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם אֲנִי אוֹמֶרֶת לְפָנֶיךָ שִׁירָה תַּחַת צַדִּיק זֶה וַעֲשֵׂהוּ מָשִׁיחַ פָּתְחָה וְאָמְרָה שִׁירָה לְפָנָיו שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר מִכְּנַף הָאָרֶץ זְמִרֹת שָׁמַעְנוּ צְבִי לַצַּדִּיק וְגוֹ'
human_translation: Immediately, the earth began and stated before Him: Master of the Universe, I recite song before You in place of that righteous person, and designate him Messiah. began and recited a song before Him, as it is stated: “From the uttermost part of the earth have we heard songs: Glory to the righteous.
llm_translation: Immediately the earth opened and said before Him, Master of the world, I declare before You a song beneath this righteous one, and make him the Messiah. It opened and said a song before Him, as it is stated, "From the edge of the earth we have heard songs: Glory to the righteous one."

hebrew_text: אָמַר שַׂר הָעוֹלָם לְפָנָיו רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם צִבְיוֹנוֹ עֲשֵׂה לַצַּדִּיק זֶה יָצְאָה בַּת קוֹל וְאָמְרָה רָזִי לִי רָזִי לִי אָמַר נָבִיא אוֹי לִי אוֹי לִי עַד מָתַי יָצְאָה בַּת קוֹל וְאָמְרָה בֹּגְדִים בָּגָדוּ וּבֶגֶד בּוֹגְדִים בָּגָדוּ וְאָמַר רָבָא וְאִיתֵּימָא רַבִּי יִצְחָק עַד דְּאָתוּ בָּזוֹזֵי וּבָזוֹזֵי דְּבָזוֹזֵי
human_translation: The angel the world said before Him: Master of the Universe, perform the will of this righteous A Divine Voice emerged and said: “My secret is Mine, My secret is Mine”; The prophet said: “Woe unto me,” woe unto me; until when A Divine Voice emerged and said: “The treacherous deal treacherously; the treacherous deal very treacherously” And Rava, and some say Rabbi Yitzḥak, says: Until looters and looters of looters come,
llm_translation: The leader of the world said before Him, the Master of the Universe, "His beauty, His adornment, make for this righteous one." A heavenly voice came forth and said, "Reveal to me, reveal to me." A prophet said, "Woe is me, woe is me, until when?" A heavenly voice came forth and said, "Betrayers have betrayed, and the treacherous have dealt treacherously." Rava said, and some say it was Rabbi Yitzchak, "Until the coins come." And the coins of the coins of the coins.

hebrew_text: מַשָּׂא דּוּמָה אֵלַי קֹרֵא מִשֵּׂעִיר שֹׁמֵר מַה מִּלַּיְלָה שֹׁמֵר מַה מִּלֵּיל וְגוֹ' אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אוֹתוֹ מַלְאָךְ הַמְמוּנֶּה עַל הָרוּחוֹת דּוּמָה שְׁמוֹ נִתְקַבְּצוּ כׇּל הָרוּחוֹת אֵצֶל דּוּמָה אָמְרוּ לוֹ שֹׁמֵר מַה מִּלַּיְלָה שֹׁמֵר מַה מִּלֵּיל אָמַר שֹׁמֵר אָתָא בֹקֶר וְגַם לָיְלָה אִם תִּבְעָיוּן בְּעָיוּ שֻׁבוּ אֵתָיוּ
human_translation: “The burden of Dumah. One calls to me out of Seir: Watchman, what of the night? Watchman, what of the night? Rabbi Yoḥanan says: That angel, who is appointed over the spirits [ seirim ], his name is Dumah. All the spirits assembled near Dumah and said to him: “Watchman of the night, what of the night? “The Watchman said: The morning comes and also the night; if you will inquire, inquire; return, come.”
llm_translation: The burden of Dumah. He calleth to me out of Seir, Watchman, what of the night? Watchman, what of the night? And so forth. Rabbi Yochanan said: That appointed angel over the winds, his name is Dumah. All the winds gather by Dumah. They said to him: Watchman, what of the night? Watchman, what of the night? He said: The morning cometh, and also the night; if ye seek, seek; return, come.

hebrew_text: תָּנָא מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי פַּפְּיָיס גְּנַאי הוּא לְחִזְקִיָּה וְסִייעָתוֹ שֶׁלֹּא אָמְרוּ שִׁירָה עַד שֶׁפָּתְחָה הָאָרֶץ וְאָמְרָה שִׁירָה שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר 'מִכְּנַף הָאָרֶץ זְמִרֹת שָׁמַעְנוּ צְבִי לַצַּדִּיק' וְגוֹ' כַּיּוֹצֵא בַּדָּבָר אַתָּה אוֹמֵר וַיֹּאמֶר יִתְרוֹ בָּרוּךְ ה' אֲשֶׁר הִצִּיל אֶתְכֶם תָּנָא מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי פַּפְּיָיס גְּנַאי הוּא לְמֹשֶׁה וְשִׁשִּׁים רִיבּוֹא שֶׁלֹּא אָמְרוּ 'בָּרוּךְ' עַד שֶׁבָּא יִתְרוֹ וְאָמַר 'בָּרוּךְ ה''
human_translation: It was taught in the name of Rabbi Pappeyas: It is a disgrace for Hezekiah and his associates that they did not recite a song until the earth began and recited a song, as it is stated: “From the uttermost part of the earth have we heard songs: Glory to the righteous” On a similar note, you say: “And Jethro said: Blessed be the Lord, Who has delivered you It was taught in the name of Rabbi Pappeyas: It is a disgrace for Moses and the six hundred thousand that they did not say: Blessed, until Yitro came and said: “Blessed be the Lord.”
llm_translation: It was taught in the name of Rabbi Pappayas: It was a disgrace for Hezekiah and his helpers that they did not say a song until the earth opened and said a song, as it is stated, "From the edge of the earth we have heard songs: Glory to the righteous one" and so on. Similarly, you say in a similar matter, "And Jethro said, 'Blessed be the Lord, who has delivered you.'" It was taught in the name of Rabbi Pappayas: It was a disgrace for Moses and the sixty myriads that they did not say 'blessed' until Jethro came and said, 'Blessed be the Lord.'

hebrew_text: וַיִּחַדְּ יִתְרוֹ רַב וּשְׁמוּאֵל רַב אָמַר שֶׁהֶעֱבִיר חֶרֶב חַדָּה עַל בְּשָׂרוֹ וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר שֶׁנַּעֲשָׂה חִדּוּדִים חִדּוּדִים כׇּל בְּשָׂרוֹ אָמַר רַב הַיְינוּ דְּאָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי גִּיּוֹרָא עַד עַשְׂרָה דָּרֵי לָא תִּבְזֵה אַרְמַאי קַמֵּיהּ
human_translation: “ Vayyiḥad Yitro Rav and Shmuel Rav says: He passed a sharp [ ḥad ] sword over his flesh, And Shmuel says: as cuts [ ḥiddudim ] were made over his flesh, Rav says this that people say: a convert, for ten generations one should not disparage a gentile before him
llm_translation: Jethro the great and Samuel the great agreed. Jethro said: he passed a sharp sword on his flesh, and Samuel said: it became bruises, bruises all over his flesh. Rav said: this is what people say, a proselyte is as hard to bear as ten generations, lest an Aramean stand before him.

hebrew_text: לָכֵן יְשַׁלַּח הָאָדוֹן ה' צְבָאוֹת בְּמִשְׁמַנָּיו רָזוֹן מַאי בְּמִשְׁמַנָּיו רָזוֹן  אָמַר הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא יָבֹא חִזְקִיָּהוּ שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ שְׁמוֹנָה שֵׁמוֹת וְיִפָּרַע מִסַּנְחֵרִיב שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ שְׁמוֹנָה שֵׁמוֹת חִזְקִיָּה דִּכְתִיב כִּי יֶלֶד יֻלַּד לָנוּ בֵּן נִתַּן לָנוּ וַתְּהִי הַמִּשְׂרָה עַל שִׁכְמוֹ וַיִּקְרָא שְׁמוֹ פֶּלֶא יוֹעֵץ אֵל גִּבּוֹר אֲבִי עַד שַׂר שָׁלוֹם וְהָאִיכָּא חִזְקִיָּה שֶׁחִזְּקוֹ יָהּ דָּבָר אַחֵר חִזְקִיָּה שֶׁחִיזֵּק אֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל לַאֲבִיהֶם שֶׁבַּשָּׁמַיִם
human_translation: “Therefore shall the Master, the Lord of hosts, send among his fat ones [ mishmanav ] leanness” What his fat ones leanness”? the Holy One, Blessed be He, said: Let Hezekiah, who has eight [ shemona ] names, come, and exact retribution from Sennacherib, who has eight names. Hezekiah as it is written: “For to us a child is born, to us a son is given; and the government is upon his shoulder; and his name is called Pele Joez El Gibbor Abi Ad Sar Shalom” But isn’t there Hezekiah? that God strengthened him [ ḥizzeko ]. Alternatively, Hezekiah that he strengthened the Jewish people to their Father in Heaven.
llm_translation: Therefore, the Lord God of hosts will send in his fatness a delight. What is "in his fatness a delight"? The Holy One, blessed be He, said: Hezekiah will come, who has eight names, and will exact vengeance from Sennacherib, who has eight names. Hezekiah, as it is written: "For a child is born to us, a son is given to us, and the government is upon his shoulder, and his name is called Wonderful Counselor, Mighty God, Eternal Father, Prince of Peace." And where is Hezekiah, who strengthened the word of the Lord? Another matter: Hezekiah, who strengthened Israel to their Father in Heaven.

hebrew_text: סַנְחֵרִיב דִּכְתִיב בֵּיהּ תִּגְלַת פִּלְאֶסֶר פִּלְנְאֶסֶר שַׁלְמַנְאֶסֶר פּוֹל סַרְגוֹן אׇסְנַפַּר רַבָּא וְיַקִּירָא וְהָאִיכָּא סַנְחֵרִיב שֶׁסִּיחָתוֹ רִיב דָּבָר אַחֵר שֶׁסָּח וְנִיחֵר דְּבָרִים כְּלַפֵּי מַעְלָה
human_translation: Sennacherib as it is written in his “Tiglath-Pileser” “ Pilneser” “Shalmaneser” “Pul” “Sargon” “the great and noble Asenappar” But isn’t there Sennacherib [ Sanḥeriv ]? that his speech is contentious [ siḥato riv ], Alternatively, that he spoke [ saḥ ] and snorted out [ niḥer ] statements vis-à-vis the Transcendent.
llm_translation: Sancheiriv, as it is written in it, "Tiglat Pil'eser, Pilneser, Shalmaneser, Pol Sar'gon, Asnapar, Rabba, and Yakira." And where is Sancheiriv? His rib is another matter, as he conversed and clarified matters according to the higher authority.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִפְּנֵי מָה זָכָה אוֹתוֹ רָשָׁע לִקְרוֹתוֹ אׇסְנַפַּר רַבָּא וְיַקִּירָא  מִפְּנֵי שֶׁלֹּא סִיפֵּר בִּגְנוּתָהּ שֶׁל אֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר עַד בֹּאִי וְלָקַחְתִּי אֶתְכֶם אֶל אֶרֶץ כְּאַרְצְכֶם
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: For what was that wicked privileged to be named “the great and noble Asenappar”? due to that he did not speak [ sipper ] in disparagement of Eretz Yisrael, as it is stated: “Until I come and take you to a land like your own”
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: For what reason did that wicked person merit to be called "Osnappar the Great and Honorable"? Because he did not speak disparagingly of the land of Israel, as it is stated, "Until I come and take you to a land like your own."

hebrew_text: רַב וּשְׁמוּאֵל חַד אָמַר מֶלֶךְ פִּקֵּחַ הָיָה וְחַד אָמַר מֶלֶךְ טִיפֵּשׁ הָיָה לְמַאן דְּאָמַר מֶלֶךְ פִּקֵּחַ הָיָה אִי אָמֵינָא לְהוּ עֲדִיפָא מֵאַרְעַיְיכוּ אָמְרוּ קָא מְשַׁקְּרַתְּ וּמַאן דְּאָמַר מֶלֶךְ טִיפֵּשׁ הָיָה אִם כֵּן מַאי רְבוּתֵיהּ
human_translation: Rav and Shmuel One says he was a clever king and one says he was a foolish king. According to the one who says he was a clever king, If I say to them: that is superior to your land, they will say: You are lying. And the one who says he was a foolish king, If so, what is his greatness
llm_translation: Rav and Shmuel, one said he was an intelligent king, and one said he was a foolish king. According to the one who said he was an intelligent king, if I were to say to you, "You are greater than your ancestors," you would call me a liar. And according to the one who said he was a foolish king, if so, what was his greatness?

hebrew_text: לְהֵיכָא אַגְּלִי לְהוּ מָר זוּטְרָא אָמַר לְאַפְרִיקִי וְרַבִּי חֲנִינָא אָמַר לְהָרֵי סְלוּג אֲבָל יִשְׂרָאֵל סִפְּרוּ בִּגְנוּתָהּ שֶׁל אֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל כִּי מְטוֹ שׂוֹשׂ אָמְרִי שָׁוְיָא כִּי אַרְעִין כִּי מְטוֹ עָלְמִין אֲמַרוּ כְּעָלְמִין כִּי מְטוֹ שׂוֹשׂ תְּרֵי אָמְרִי עַל חַד תְּרֵין
human_translation: To where did exile Mar Zutra says: to Afrikei, and Rabbi Ḥanina says: To the Selug Mountains. But Israel spoke in disparagement of Eretz Yisrael When they arrived Shosh, they said: It is equal [ shaveh ] to our land. When they arrived Almin, they said: like our world [ almin ], When they arrived Shosh the second [ terei ], they said: For one two [ terein ]
llm_translation: To where should the Master reveal himself? Zutra said: To Aphriki. And Rabbi Chanina said: To the mountains of S'luga. But the Israelites counted the praises of the Land of Israel, for when it is joyful, they say, "It is good," like the world, for when it is ancient, they say, "As of old," like the world. When it is joyful, they say, "Two," and when it is sad, "One."

hebrew_text: וְתַחַת כְּבֹדוֹ [יֵקַד] יְקֹד כִּיקוֹד אֵשׁ אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן תַּחַת כְּבוֹדוֹ  וְלֹא כְּבוֹדוֹ מַמָּשׁ כִּי הָא דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן קָרֵי לֵיהּ לְמָאנֵיהּ מְכַבְּדוֹתַי רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אָמַר תַּחַת כְּבוֹדוֹ מַמָּשׁ כִּשְׂרֵיפַת בְּנֵי אַהֲרֹן מָה לְהַלָּן שְׂרֵיפַת נְשָׁמָה וְגוּף קַיָּים  אַף כָּאן שְׂרֵיפַת נְשָׁמָה וְגוּף קַיָּים
human_translation: “And beneath his glory shall be kindled a blaze like the blaze of a fire” Rabbi Yoḥanan says: beneath his glory, but not actually his glory. as that of Rabbi Yoḥanan, call his garments: My glory. Rabbi Elazar says: beneath his actual glory, like the burning of the sons of Aaron. Just as there, the burning of the soul, and the body intact, so too here, the burning of the soul, and the body intact.
llm_translation: And under His glory He will kindle He will kindle like the burning of fire. Rabbi Yochanan said: "Under His glory, and not His actual glory." For this is what Rabbi Yochanan called his disciples, "my honorable ones." Rabbi Elazar said: "Under His actual glory, like the burning of the sons of Aaron." Just as there, the burning of the soul and the body remained, so too here, the burning of the soul and the body remain.

hebrew_text: תָּנָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן קׇרְחָה פַּרְעֹה שֶׁחֵירַף בְּעַצְמוֹ  נִפְרַע הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא מִמֶּנּוּ בְּעַצְמוֹ סַנְחֵרִיב שֶׁחֵירַף
human_translation: It was taught in the name of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korḥa: Pharaoh, who himself blasphemed the Holy One, Blessed be He, Himself exacted retribution from him. Sennacherib, who blasphemed
llm_translation: It was taught in the name of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korcha: Pharaoh, who blasphemed himself, the Holy One, blessed be He, took retribution from him himself. Sancheriv, who blasphemed himself.

hebrew_text: עַל יְדֵי שָׁלִיחַ  נִפְרַע הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא מִמֶּנּוּ עַל יְדֵי שָׁלִיחַ
human_translation: by means of an agent, the Holy One, Blessed be He, exacted retribution from him by means of an agent.
llm_translation: By means of a messenger, the Holy One, blessed be He, exacts payment from him by means of a messenger.

hebrew_text: פַּרְעֹה דִּכְתִיב בֵּיהּ מִי ה' אֲשֶׁר אֶשְׁמַע בְּקֹלוֹ נִפְרַע הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא מִמֶּנּוּ בְּעַצְמוֹ דִּכְתִיב וַיְנַעֵר ה' אֶת מִצְרַיִם בְּתוֹךְ הַיָּם וּכְתִיב דָּרַכְתָּ בַּיָּם סוּסֶיךָ וְגוֹ' סַנְחֵרִיב דִּכְתִיב בְּיַד מַלְאָכֶיךָ חֵרַפְתָּ ה' נִפְרַע הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא מִמֶּנּוּ עַל יְדֵי שָׁלִיחַ דִּכְתִיב וַיֵּצֵא מַלְאַךְ ה' וַיַּךְ בְּמַחֲנֵה אַשּׁוּר מֵאָה שְׁמוֹנִים וַחֲמִשָּׁה אֶלֶף וְגוֹ'
human_translation: Pharaoh as it is written “Who is the Lord that I should obey His voice?” The Holy One, Blessed be He, Himself exacted retribution from him, as it is written: “And the Lord overthrew Egypt in the midst of the sea” and it is written: “You have trodden through the sea with Your horses” Sennacherib as it is written: “By your messengers you have taunted the Lord” The Holy One, Blessed be He, exacted retribution from him by means of an agent, as it is written: “Then the angel of the Lord went forth and smote in the camp of the Assyrians one hundred and eighty-five thousand”
llm_translation: Pharaoh as it is written in it "Who is the LORD that I should obey His voice?" The Holy One, blessed be He, took retribution from him Himself as it is written "And the LORD shook off the Egyptians into the midst of the sea." And it is written "You trampled with your horses through the sea" and "You shattered the heads of the dragons in the waters." Sennacherib as it is written "By the hand of your messengers you have defied the Lord." The Holy One, blessed be He, took retribution from him through an agent as it is written "And the angel of the LORD went out and struck down 185,000 in the camp of Assyria."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בַּר פָּפָּא רָמֵי כְּתִיב מְרוֹם קִצּוֹ וּכְתִיב מְלוֹן קִצּוֹ אָמַר אוֹתוֹ רָשָׁע בַּתְּחִלָּה אַחְרִיב דִּירָה שֶׁל מַטָּה וְאַחַר כָּךְ אַחְרִיב דִּירָה שֶׁל מַעְלָה
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina bar Pappa raises a contradiction. It is written into its farthest height” and it is written into its farthest lodge” That wicked person said: Initially, I will destroy dwelling place below, and thereafter, I will destroy dwelling place above,
llm_translation: Rabbi Chanina bar Papa raised a contradiction: It is written "its topmost height" and it is written "its bottommost height." He said: That wicked person first destroyed the dwelling of the lower level, and only afterwards destroyed the dwelling of the upper level.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי מַאי דִּכְתִיב עַתָּה הֲמִבַּלְעֲדֵי ה' עָלִיתִי עַל הַמָּקוֹם הַזֶּה לְהַשְׁחִתוֹ ה' אָמַר אֵלַי עֲלֵה עַל הָאָרֶץ הַזֹּאת וְהַשְׁחִיתָהּ מַאי הִיא דִּשְׁמַע לִנְבִיָּא דְּקָאָמַר יַעַן כִּי מָאַס הָעָם הַזֶּה אֵת מֵי הַשִּׁלֹחַ הַהוֹלְכִים לְאַט וּמְשׂוֹשׂ אֶת רְצִין וּבֶן רְמַלְיָהוּ
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi says: What which is written “Have I now come up without the Lord against this place to destroy it? The Lord said to me: Go up against this land and destroy it” What is that he heard the prophet who said: “Since the people rejected the waters of Shiloah that flow slowly and rejoice with Rezin and the son of Remaliah.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: What is the meaning of the verse, "Now, is it without the Lord that I have come up against this place to destroy it?" The Lord said to me, "Go up against this land and destroy it." What is it that he heard from the prophet who said, "Because this people has rejected the waters of Shiloah that flow gently, and rejoices over Rezin and the son of Remaliah"?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף אִלְמָלֵא תַּרְגּוּמָא דְּהַאי קְרָא לָא הֲוָה יָדַעְנָא מַאי קָאָמַר חֲלַף דְּקָץ עַמָּא הָדֵין בְּמַלְכוּתָא דְּבֵית דָּוִד דִּמְדַבַּר לְהוֹן בִּנְיָיח כְּמֵי שִׁילוֹחָא דְּנָגְדִין בִּנְיָיח וְאִיתְרְעִיאוּ בִּרְצִין וּבַר רְמַלְיָה
human_translation: Rav Yosef says: Were it not for the translation of this verse I would not know what it is saying. Since this people loathed the reign of the house of David that led them gently, like the waters of the Shiloah, which flow gently, and they preferred Rezin and the son of Remaliah,
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: Were it not for the Aramaic translation of this verse, I would not have known what it means. "He passed through the sea, the same sea where the children of Israel passed through, and they rejoiced in Him, and in His kingdom, the kingdom of the house of David."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מַאי דִּכְתִיב מְאֵרַת ה' בְּבֵית רָשָׁע וּנְוֵה צַדִּיקִים יְבָרֵךְ מְאֵרַת ה' בְּבֵית רָשָׁע  זֶה פֶּקַח בֶּן רְמַלְיָהוּ שֶׁהָיָה אוֹכֵל אַרְבָּעִים סְאָה גּוֹזָלוֹת בְּקִינּוּחַ סְעוּדָה וּנְוֵה צַדִּיקִים יְבָרֵךְ  זֶה חִזְקִיָּה מֶלֶךְ יְהוּדָה שֶׁהָיָה אוֹכֵל לִיטְרָא יָרָק בִּסְעוּדָה
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: What which is written: “The curse of the Lord is in the house of the wicked, but He blesses the habitation of the just” “The curse of the Lord is in the house of the wicked”; this is Pekah, son of Remaliah, who would eat forty se’a of fledglings for dessert “But He blesses the habitation of the just”; this is Hezekiah, king of Judea, who would eat a litra of vegetables at meal
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: What is the meaning of what is written, "The curse of the Lord is in the house of the wicked, but He blesses the dwelling of the righteous" (Proverbs 3:33)? "The curse of the Lord is in the house of the wicked" – this refers to Pekach son of Remalyahu, who would consume forty se'ah of stolen goods in a single meal. "But He blesses the dwelling of the righteous" – this refers to King Hezekiah of Judah, who would eat a single leek at his meal.

hebrew_text: וְלָכֵן הִנֵּה ה' מַעֲלֶה עֲלֵיהֶם אֶת מֵי הַנָּהָר הָעֲצוּמִים וְהָרַבִּים אֶת מֶלֶךְ אַשּׁוּר וּכְתִיב וְחָלַף בִּיהוּדָה שָׁטַף וְעָבַר עַד צַוָּאר יַגִּיעַ
human_translation: “Now therefore, behold, the Lord brings up upon them the strong and abundant waters of the river, the king of Assyria” And it is written: “And he shall sweep through Judea; he shall inundate and pass through, reaching even the neck”
llm_translation: And therefore behold, Hashem raises against them the mighty and numerous waters of the river, the king of Assyria. And it is written, "And he shall pass through Judah; he shall overflow and go over, reaching even to the neck."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מַאי טַעְמָא אִיעֲנִישׁ נְבִיָּא אַעֲשֶׂרֶת הַשְּׁבָטִים אִיתְנַבִּי אִיהוּ יְהַיב דַּעְתֵּיהּ עַל כּוּלַּהּ יְרוּשָׁלֶם בָּא נָבִיא וְאָמַר לוֹ כִּי לֹא מוּעָף לַאֲשֶׁר מוּצָק לָהּ אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בַּר בֶּרֶכְיָה אֵין נִמְסָר עַם עָיֵיף בַּתּוֹרָה בְּיַד מִי הַמֵּצִיק לוֹ
human_translation: But what is the reason was punished The prophet prophesied about the ten tribes, he directed his attention to all of Jerusalem. The prophet came and said to him: “For there is no weariness [ mu’af ] that is set [ mutzak ] against her” Rabbi Elazar bar Berekhya says A nation weary [ ayef ] in Torah is not delivered into the hands of one who oppresses [ metzik ] it.
llm_translation: Rather what reason? Punish prophet ten tribes prophesied he gave his mind on all Jerusalem came prophet said to him for not a moth to what is pressed to it said Rabbi Elazar son of Berachiah not delivered people weary in Torah by whom presses to him

hebrew_text: מַאי כָּעֵת הָרִאשׁוֹן הֵקַל אַרְצָה זְבוּלֻן וְאַרְצָה נַפְתָּלִי וְהָאַחֲרוֹן הִכְבִּיד דֶּרֶךְ הַיָּם עֵבֶר הַיַּרְדֵּן גְּלִיל הַגּוֹיִם  לֹא כָּרִאשׁוֹנִים שֶׁהֵקֵלּוּ מֵעֲלֵיהֶם עוֹל תּוֹרָה אֲבָל אַחֲרוֹנִים שֶׁהִכְבִּידוּ עֲלֵיהֶן עוֹל תּוֹרָה וּרְאוּיִין הַלָּלוּ לַעֲשׂוֹת לָהֶם נֵס כְּעוֹבְרֵי הַיָּם וּכְדוֹרְכֵי הַיַּרְדֵּן אִם חוֹזֵר בּוֹ  מוּטָב וְאִם לָאו  אֲנִי אֶעֱשֶׂה לוֹ גָּלִיל בַּגּוֹיִם
human_translation: What “Now the former has lightly afflicted [ hakel ] the land of Zebulun and the land of Naphtali but the latter has dealt a more grievous blow [ hikhbid ] by way of the sea, beyond the Jordan in the district [ gelil ] of the nations”? not like the former who eased [ hekellu ] the yoke of Torah from upon But latter who intensified [ hikhbidu ] the yoke of Torah upon is fit to perform for them like those who crossed the Sea and those who trod the Jordan If reconsiders good, but if not, I will render him wallowing [ galil ] among the nations.
llm_translation: What is the meaning of "Ka'et"? The first lightened, the land of Zebulun and the land of Naphtali, and the last one made heavy, the way of the sea, beyond the Jordan, Galilee of the nations. Not like the first ones who lightened the burden of the Torah from upon them, but the last ones who made it heavy upon them, the burden of the Torah. And these are fitting to perform a miracle for them, like those who crossed the sea and like those who crossed the Jordan. If one repents, it is better, and if not, "I will make him a circuit in the nations."

hebrew_text: אַחֲרֵי הַדְּבָרִים וְהָאֱמֶת הָאֵלֶּה בָּא סַנְחֵרִיב מֶלֶךְ אַשּׁוּר וַיָּבֹא בִיהוּדָה וַיִּחַן עַל הֶעָרִים הַבְּצֻרוֹת וַיֹּאמֶר לְבִקְעָם אֵלָיו הַאי רִישָׁנָא לְהַאי פַּרְדָּשְׁנָא
human_translation: “After these matters and this truth, Sennacherib, king of Assyria, came and entered Judea and encamped against the fortified cities and sought to breach them for himself” this gift [ rishna ], for that gift [ pardashna ],
llm_translation: After the matters and the truth, these came Sancheriv king of Assyria and he came to Judah and encamped against the fortified cities and said to break them, "To me this first for this second."

hebrew_text: אַחֲרֵי הַדְּבָרִים וְהָאֱמֶת אַחַר מַאי אָמַר רָבִינָא לְאַחַר שֶׁקָּפַץ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא וְנִשְׁבַּע וְאָמַר אִי אָמֵינָא לֵיהּ לְחִזְקִיָּה מַיְיתֵינָא לֵיהּ לְסַנְחֵרִיב וּמָסַרְנָא לֵיהּ בִּידָךְ הַשְׁתָּא אָמַר לָא הוּא בָּעֵינָא וְלָא בִּיעֲתוּתֵיהּ בָּעֵינָא
human_translation: “After matters and truth [ emet ],” after what Ravina says: after the Holy One, Blessed be He, preempted and took an oath, And He said: If I say to Hezekiah: I will bring Sennacherib and I will deliver him into your hands; he will say: I neither want him nor do I want fear him.
llm_translation: After the matters and the truth, after what did Ravina say?
