After the Holy One, blessed be He, became angry and swore, saying, "If I do not believe him, I will deliver Hezekiah to Sennacherib." And we were handed over to him. Now he said, "It is not necessary now, and not in his fear do I need."

hebrew_text: מִיָּד קָפַץ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא וְנִשְׁבַּע דְּמַיְיתֵינָא לֵיהּ שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר נִשְׁבַּע ה' צְבָאוֹת לֵאמֹר אִם לֹא כַּאֲשֶׁר דִּמִּיתִי כֵּן הָיָתָה וְכַאֲשֶׁר יָעַצְתִּי הִיא תָקוּם לִשְׁבֹּר אַשּׁוּר בְּאַרְצִי וְעַל הָרַי אֲבוּסֶנּוּ וְסָר מֵעֲלֵיהֶם עֻלּוֹ וְסֻבֳּלוֹ מֵעַל שִׁכְמוֹ יָסוּר אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא יָבֹא סַנְחֵרִיב וְסִיעָתוֹ וְיֵעָשֶׂה אֵבוּס לְחִזְקִיָּהוּ וּלְסִיעָתוֹ
human_translation: Immediately, the Holy One, Blessed be He, preempted and took an oath: that I will deliver him, as it is stated: “The Lord of hosts has taken an oath, saying: Is it not as I imagined it, so has it come to pass; and as I have proposed, so shall it arise, that I will break Assyria in My land, and upon My mountains subdue him [ avusennu ]; then shall his yoke depart from them, and his burden depart from its shoulder” Rabbi Yoḥanan says the Holy One, Blessed be He, said: Sennacherib and his entourage shall come and be transformed into trough [ evus ], for Hezekiah and his entourage.
llm_translation: Immediately, the Holy One, blessed be He, jumped up and swore that our blood would be avenged, as it is stated, "The Lord of hosts has sworn, saying: Surely as I have thought, so shall it come to pass; and as I have purposed, so shall it stand: To break Assyria in My land, and upon My mountains trample him; then shall his yoke depart from them, and his burden depart from their shoulder." Rabbi Yochanan said: The Holy One, blessed be He, will bring Sancheriv and his entourage, and make a disgrace for Hezekiah and his entourage.

hebrew_text: וְהָיָה בַּיּוֹם הַהוּא יָסוּר סֻבֳּלוֹ מֵעַל שִׁכְמֶךָ וְעֻלּוֹ מֵעַל צַוָּארֶךָ וְחֻבַּל עֹל מִפְּנֵי שָׁמֶן אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק נַפָּחָא חוּבַּל עוֹל שֶׁל סַנְחֵרִיב מִפְּנֵי שַׁמְנוֹ שֶׁל חִזְקִיָּהוּ שֶׁהָיָה דּוֹלֵק בְּבָתֵּי כְנֵסִיּוֹת וּבְבָתֵּי מִדְרָשׁוֹת
human_translation: “And it shall come to pass on that day, his burden shall be taken from on your shoulder, and his yoke from on your neck, and the yoke shall be destroyed due to fatness [ shamen ]” Rabbi Yitzḥak Nappaḥa says: The yoke of Sennacherib was destroyed due to the oil [ shemen ] of Hezekiah that would burn in the synagogues and study halls
llm_translation: And it shall be on that day, the burden shall be removed from your shoulder, and the yoke from your neck, and the yoke shall be destroyed because of the anointing oil. Rabbi Yitzchak Nappacha said: The yoke of Sancheriv was destroyed because of the oil of Hezekiah, which was burning in the synagogues and study halls.

hebrew_text: מָה עָשָׂה נָעַץ חֶרֶב עַל פֶּתַח בֵּית הַמִּדְרָשׁ וְאָמַר כׇּל מִי שֶׁאֵינוֹ עוֹסֵק בַּתּוֹרָה יִדָּקֵר בְּחֶרֶב זוֹ בָּדְקוּ מִדָּן וְעַד בְּאֵר שֶׁבַע וְלֹא מָצְאוּ עַם הָאָרֶץ מִגְּבָת וְעַד אַנְטִיפְרַס וְלֹא מָצְאוּ תִּינוֹק וְתִינוֹקֶת אִישׁ וְאִשָּׁה שֶׁלֹּא הָיוּ בְּקִיאִין בְּהִלְכוֹת טוּמְאָה וְטׇהֳרָה
human_translation: What did do He inserted a sword at the entrance of the study hall and said: Anyone who does not engage in Torah shall be stabbed with this sword. they searched from Dan to Beersheba and did not find an ignoramus. from Gevat to Antipatris and did not find a male child, or a female child, a man, or a woman who was not expert in the halakhot of ritual purity and impurity.
llm_translation: What did Na'atz do? He placed a sword at the entrance of the study hall and said, "Anyone who does not engage in Torah study will be pierced by this sword." They searched from Dan to Beersheba and did not find an 'am ha'aretz from Geba to Antipatris, nor did they find a young boy or girl, man or woman, who were not knowledgeable in the laws of purity and impurity.

hebrew_text: וְעַל אוֹתוֹ הַדּוֹר הוּא אוֹמֵר וְהָיָה בַּיּוֹם הַהוּא יְחַיֶּה אִישׁ עֶגְלַת בָּקָר וּשְׁתֵּי צֹאן וְגוֹ' וְאוֹמֵר וְהָיָה בַּיּוֹם הַהוּא יִהְיֶה כׇל מָקוֹם אֲשֶׁר יִהְיֶה שָּׁם אֶלֶף גֶּפֶן בְּאֶלֶף כָּסֶף לַשָּׁמִיר וְלַשַּׁיִת יִהְיֶה אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֶלֶף גֶּפֶן בְּאֶלֶף כָּסֶף  לַשָּׁמִיר וְלַשַּׁיִת יִהְיֶה
human_translation: And about that generation says: “And it shall come to pass in that day, that a man shall nourish a young calf and two sheep. And says: “And it shall come to pass in that day that every place where there were one thousand vines for one thousand silver coins, it shall be for briars and thorns” Although one thousand vines are worth one thousand silver coins will briars and thorns
llm_translation: And regarding that generation, it says, "And it shall be on that day, a man shall keep alive a young cow of a bull and two sheep, etc." And it says, "And it shall be on that day, every place where there were a thousand vines at a thousand silver coins, it shall be for briers and thorns. Even though one shall give a thousand vines at a thousand silver coins for briers and thorns, it shall be."

hebrew_text: וְאֻסַּף שְׁלַלְכֶם אֹסֶף הֶחָסִיל אָמַר לָהֶם נָבִיא לְיִשְׂרָאֵל אִסְפוּ שְׁלַלְכֶם אָמְרוּ לוֹ לִבְזוֹז אוֹ לַחְלוֹק אָמַר לָהֶם 'כְּאֹסֶף הֶחָסִיל' מָה אֹסֶף הֶחָסִיל  כׇּל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד לְעַצְמוֹ אַף שְׁלַלְכֶם  כׇּל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד לְעַצְמוֹ
human_translation: “And your spoils shall be gathered like the gathering of the locusts; The prophet said to the Jewish people: Gather your spoils They said to him: to pillage or to divide He said to them: like the gathering by the locusts. Just as the gathering by the locusts, each and every one for itself, so too, your spoils, each and every one for himself.
llm_translation: "And the spoils of you shall be gathered, gatherer of the gazelle. The prophet said to the children of Israel, 'Gather your spoils.' They said to him, 'For plunder or for division?' He said to them, 'Like the gatherer of the gazelle.' Just as the gatherer of the gazelle, each one for himself, so too your spoils, each one for himself."

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ לוֹ וַהֲלֹא מָמוֹן עֲשֶׂרֶת הַשְּׁבָטִים מְעוֹרָב בּוֹ אָמַר לָהֶם 'כְּמַשַּׁק גֵּבִים שׁוֹקֵק בּוֹ' מָה גֵּבִים הַלָּלוּ מַעֲלִין אֶת הָאָדָם מִטּוּמְאָה לְטׇהֳרָה אַף מָמוֹנָם שֶׁל יִשְׂרָאֵל כֵּיוָן שֶׁנָּפַל בְּיַד אוּמּוֹת הָעוֹלָם מִיָּד טִיהַר כִּדְרַב פָּפָּא דְּאָמַר רַב פָּפָּא עַמּוֹן וּמוֹאָב טָהֲרוּ בְּסִיחוֹן
human_translation: They said to him: isn’t the property of the ten tribes intermingled with it, He said to them: “As the advance of the locusts [ gevim ] shall he advance” Just as these pools elevate a person up from ritual impurity to purity so too the property of the Jewish people, once it falls into the hands of gentiles, it immediately purifies in accordance with of Rav Pappa, as Rav Pappa says: Ammon and Moab was purified through Sihon.
llm_translation: They said to him, "But isn't the money of the ten tribes mixed in it?" He said to them, "Like a sieve that strains it." Just as these sieves elevate a person from impurity to purity, so too their money of the Israelites, once it falls into the hands of the nations of the world, immediately becomes purified, as Rav Papa said, "Ammon and Moab were purified in Sichon."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא עֶשֶׂר מַסָּעוֹת נָסַע אוֹתוֹ רָשָׁע בְּאוֹתוֹ הַיּוֹם שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר בָּא עַל עַיַּת עָבַר בְּמִגְרוֹן לְמִכְמָשׂ יַפְקִיד כֵּלָיו עָבְרוּ מַעְבָּרָה גֶּבַע מָלוֹן לָנוּ חָרְדָה הָרָמָה גִּבְעַת שָׁאוּל נָסָה צַהֲלִי קוֹלֵךְ בַּת גַּלִּים הַקְשִׁיבִי לַיְשָׁה עֲנִיָּה עֲנָתוֹת נָדְדָה מַדְמֵנָה יֹשְׁבֵי הַגֵּבִים הֵעִיזוּ עוֹד הַיּוֹם בְּנֹב לַעֲמֹד יְנֹפֵף יָדוֹ הַר בַּת צִיּוֹן גִּבְעַת יְרוּשָׁלִָם
human_translation: Rav Huna says: That wicked traveled ten journeys on that day, as it is stated: “He is come to Aiath, he is passed through Migron; at Michmas he deposited his baggage. They passed [ averu ] Mabara; they have taken up their lodging at Geba; Ramah trembles; Gibeath Shaul has fled. Cry with a shrill voice, daughter of Gallim; hearken, Laish; poor Anathoth. Madmenah is in flight; the inhabitants of Gebim flee to cover. This very day shall he halt at Nov; he shall shake his hand against the mountain of the daughter of Zion, the hill of Jerusalem”
llm_translation: Rav Huna said: Ten stages did that wicked one travel on that day, as it is said, "He has come to Aiath, he has passed through Migron; at Michmash he deposits his baggage. They have crossed over the pass; Geba is our lodging place. Ramah trembles; Gibeah of Saul has fled. Cry aloud with your voice, O daughter of Gallim! Listen, Laishah! Poor Anathoth! Madmenah has fled. The inhabitants of Gebim gather themselves to flee. Yet today he will halt at Nob; he will shake his fist at the mount of the daughter of Zion, the hill of Jerusalem."

hebrew_text: הָנֵי טוּבָא הָוְיָין צַהֲלִי קוֹלֵךְ בַּת גַּלִּים נָבִיא הוּא דְּקָאָמַר לַהּ לִכְנֶסֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל צַהֲלִי קוֹלֵךְ בַּת גַּלִּים בִּתּוֹ שֶׁל אַבְרָהָם יִצְחָק וְיַעֲקֹב שֶׁעָשׂוּ מִצְוֹת כְּגַלֵּי הַיָּם (הַקְשִׁיבָה) [הַקְשִׁיבִי] לַיְשָׁה מֵהַאי לָא תִּסְתְּפַי אֶלָּא אִיסְתְּפַי מִנְּבוּכַדְנֶצַּר הָרָשָׁע דִּמְתִיל כְּאַרְיֵה שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר עָלָה אַרְיֵה מִסֻּבְּכוֹ וְגוֹ'
human_translation: Aren’t these more “Cry with a shrill voice, daughter of Gallim,” the prophet who is saying it to the congregation of Israel: “Cry with a shrill voice, daughter of Gallim,” daughter of Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, who performed mitzvot as the waves of the sea. “Hearken, Laish”; from this fear not; but fear Nebuchadnezzar, the wicked who is likened to a lion, as it is stated: “The lion [ arye ] is gone up from its thicket”
llm_translation: These are the words of the good ones, "Raise your voice, O daughter of waves, for a prophet is he who says to her, 'O assembly of Israel, raise your voice, O daughter of waves, daughter of Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, who performed commandments like the waves of the sea.' Listen, O woman, from this one you will not be redeemed, but you will be redeemed from Nebuchadnezzar the wicked, who roars like a lion, as it is said, 'The lion has come up from his thicket.'"

hebrew_text: מַאי
human_translation: What
llm_translation: What is it?

hebrew_text: עֲנִיָּה עֲנָתוֹת  עָתִיד יִרְמְיָה בֶּן חִלְקִיָּה וּמִתְנַבֵּא עֲלַהּ מֵעֲנָתוֹת דִּכְתִיב דִּבְרֵי יִרְמְיָהוּ בֶּן חִלְקִיָּהוּ מִן הַכֹּהֲנִים אֲשֶׁר בַּעֲנָתוֹת בְּאֶרֶץ בִּנְיָמִין
human_translation: “Poor [ aniyya ] Anathoth” Jeremiah, son of Hilkiah, is destined to prophesy about from Anathoth, as it is written: “The statements of Jeremiah, son of Hilkiah, of the priests who were in Anathoth in the land of Benjamin”
llm_translation: "Aniyah Anathot, Yirmiyahu ben Chilkiyah, u'mitnabbe alah me'Anathot, dikhtiv divrei Yirmiyahu ben Chilkiyahu min hakohanim asher ba'Anathot be'eretz Binyamin." "Poor Anathoth, Jeremiah son of Hilkiah, and prophesied concerning it from Anathoth, as it is written, the words of Jeremiah son of Hilkiah from the priests who were in Anathoth in the land of Benjamin."

hebrew_text: מִי דָּמֵי הָתָם אֲרִי הָכָא לַיִשׁ אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן שִׁשָּׁה שֵׁמוֹת יֵשׁ לַאֲרִי אֵלּוּ הֵן אֲרִי כְּפִיר לָבִיא לַיִשׁ שַׁחַל שַׁחַץ אִי הָכִי בָּצְרוּ לְהוּ עָבְרוּ מַעְבָּרָה תַּרְתֵּי נִינְהוּ
human_translation: Are these comparable? There, ari , here, laish . Rabbi Yoḥanan says: There are six terms for the lion, they are: Ari , kefir , lavi , layish , shaḥal , shaḥatz . If so are too few, Averu Mabara two
llm_translation: Who is similar there lion here to the man said Rabbi Yochanan six names to the lion these are lion young lion lioness lion wild ox tiger if so they transgressed they passed through two of them

hebrew_text: מַאי עוֹד הַיּוֹם בְּנֹב לַעֲמֹד אָמַר רַב הוּנָא אוֹתוֹ הַיּוֹם נִשְׁתַּיֵּיר מֵעֲוֹנָהּ שֶׁל נוֹב אָמְרִי לֵיהּ כַּלְדָּאֵי אִי אָזְלַתְּ הָאִידָּנָא  יָכְלַתְּ לַהּ וְאִי לָא  לָא יָכְלַתְּ לַהּ אוֹרְחָא דִּבְעָא לְסַגּוֹיֵי בְּעַשְׂרָה יוֹמֵי סַגֵּא בְּחַד יוֹמָא
human_translation: What “This very day shall he halt at Nov” Rav Huna says: That day remained from the sin of Nov The astrologers said to If you go now, you will overcome and if not, you will not overcome He walked in one day a road which one must walk for ten days
llm_translation: What is the additional aspect of the day in Nob to stand? Rav Huna said: That day was spared from the sin of Nob. They say to him: Like a bucket, if you had gone now, you could have, and if not, you could not have. The way of one who wants to be precise, in ten days he can achieve in one day.

hebrew_text: כִּי מְטוֹ לִירוּשְׁלֶם שְׁדוֹ לֵיהּ בִּיסְתַּרְקֵי עַד דִּסְלֵיק וִיתֵיב מֵעִילָּוֵי שׁוּרָא עַד דְּחַזְיַוהּ לְכוּלַּהּ יְרוּשְׁלֶם כִּי חַזְיַיהּ אִיזּוּטַר בְּעֵינֵיהּ אָמַר הֲלָא דָּא הִיא קַרְתָּא דִּירוּשְׁלֶם דַּעֲלַהּ אַרְגֵּישִׁית כֹּל מַשְׁירְיָתַי וַעֲלַהּ כַּבֵּשִׁית כֹּל מְדִינָתָא הֲלָא הִיא זְעֵירָא וְחַלָּשָׁא מִכֹּל כַּרְכֵי עַמְמַיָּא דְּכַבֵּשִׁית בִּתְקוֹף יְדַי עֲלַהּ וְקָם וּמָנֵיד בְּרֵישֵׁיהּ מוֹבֵיל וּמַיְיתֵי בִּידֵיהּ עַל טוּר בֵּית מַקְדְּשָׁא דִּבְצִיּוֹן וְעַל עֲזַרְתָּא דְּבִירוּשְׁלֶם
human_translation: When they arrived in Jerusalem they cast mats [ bistarkei ] for until he ascended and sat above the wall, to the extent that he see the entire Jerusalem. When he saw it, it small in his eyes he said: Is this the city of Jerusalem for which I have disrupted all my camps and for which I have conquered all countries? Is it smaller and weaker than all the cities of the nations that I have conquered with my might? He went up and shook his head waved his hand at the Temple Mount that is in Zion and at the courtyard that is in Jerusalem.
llm_translation: When he arrived at Jerusalem, he would circle around it until he ascended and sat on a high place and saw the whole of Jerusalem. When he saw it, he would say, "Is this the beauty of Jerusalem that the Scripture speaks of, 'The perfection of beauty, God shines forth' (Psalms 50:2)? It ascends like a lion and rules over all the other provinces. Is it not small and weak compared to all the other kingdoms that rule over it? Yet, it ascends with its might, stands up, shakes its head, and brings in its hand upon the Temple Mount in Zion and upon the Temple Courtyard in Jerusalem."

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי נִישְׁדֵּי בֵּיהּ יְדָא הָאִידָּנָא אֲמַר לְהוּ תָּמְהִיתוּ לִמְחַר אַיְיתוֹ לִי כֹּל חַד וְחַד מִינַּיְיכוּ גּוּלְמוֹ הֲרַג מִינֵּיהּ מִיָּד וַיְהִי בַּלַּיְלָה הַהוּא וַיֵּצֵא מַלְאַךְ ה' וַיַּךְ בְּמַחֲנֵה אַשּׁוּר מֵאָה שְׁמוֹנִים וַחֲמִשָּׁה אָלֶף וַיַּשְׁכִּימוּ בַבֹּקֶר וְהִנֵּה כֻלָּם פְּגָרִים מֵתִים אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא הַיְינוּ דְּאָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי בָּת דִּינָא  בְּטַל דִּינָא
human_translation: said Let us attack now said to them: You are weary. Tomorrow, each and every one of you will bring me a piece from seal [ gulmo harag ] immediately: “And it came to pass that night, that the angel of the Lord went forth and smote in the camp of the Assyrians one hundred and eighty-five thousand; and when men arose in the morning, behold, they were all dead corpses” Rav Pappa says this that people say: quarrel lies the quarrel is nullified.
llm_translation: The scholars asked him: "This hand, the one that was just mentioned, did he say to them, 'Wait until tomorrow, and each of you bring me one of your types, and the one who is guilty will be killed immediately?' And it was that very night, an angel of the Lord went out and struck down in the camp of Assyria one hundred and eighty-five thousand. They arose in the morning, and behold, they were all dead bodies." Rav Papa said: "This is what people say, 'The daughter of the judge has annulled the judgment.'"

hebrew_text: וְיִשְׁבִּי בְּנֹב אֲשֶׁר בִּילִידֵי הָרָפָה וּמִשְׁקַל קֵינוֹ שְׁלֹשׁ מֵאוֹת מִשְׁקַל נְחֹשֶׁת וְהוּא חָגוּר חֲדָשָׁה וַיֹּאמֶר לְהַכּוֹת אֶת דָּוִד מַאי וְיִשְׁבִּי בְּנוֹב אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב אִישׁ שֶׁבָּא עַל עִסְקֵי נוֹב אֲמַר לֵיהּ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לְדָוִד עַד מָתַי יִהְיֶה עָוֹן זֶה טָמוּן בְּיָדְךָ עַל יָדְךָ נֶהֶרְגָה נוֹב עִיר הַכֹּהֲנִים וְעַל יָדְךָ נִטְרַד דּוֹאֵג הָאֲדוֹמִי וְעַל יָדְךָ נֶהֶרְגוּ שָׁאוּל וּשְׁלֹשֶׁת בָּנָיו
human_translation: “And Ishbibenob, who was of the sons of the giant, the weight of whose spear was three hundred shekels of brass; and he was girded with new armor and planned to slay David” What Ishbibenob? Rav Yehuda says Rav says: a man [ ish ] who came over matters of Nov. The Holy One, Blessed be He, said to David: Until when will this sin be concealed in your hand Through your Nov, the city of priests, were massacred, and through your Doeg the Edomite was banished and through your Saul and his three sons were killed.
llm_translation: And he dwelt in Nob, which is in the land of the Raphah, and the weight of his spear was three hundred shekels of bronze, and he was girded with a new sword, and he said to strike David. What is "And he dwelt in Nob"? Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: One of the men of Nob said to him, the Holy One, blessed be He, to David, "How long will this sin be hidden in your hand? Nob, the city of the priests, will be killed by you, and Doeg the Edomite will be oppressed by you, and Saul and his three sons will be killed by you."

hebrew_text: רְצוֹנְךָ יִכְלֶה זַרְעֶךָ אוֹ תִּמָּסֵר בְּיַד אוֹיֵב אָמַר לְפָנָיו רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם מוּטָב אֶמָּסֵר בְּיַד אוֹיֵב וְלֹא יִכְלֶה זַרְעִי
human_translation: Is it your desire your descendants will cease or you will be handed to the enemy? said before Him: Master of the Universe, it is preferable I will be handed to the enemy and my descendants will not cease
llm_translation: Your will shall consume your seed, or be delivered into the hand of the enemy. He said before Him: "Master of the Universe, it is better that I be delivered into the hand of the enemy and my seed not be consumed."

hebrew_text: יוֹמָא חַד נְפַק לִשְׁכוֹר בָּזָאֵי אֲתָא שָׂטָן וְאִידְּמִי לֵיהּ כְּטַבְיָא פְּתַק בֵּיהּ גִּירָא וְלָא מַטְיֵיהּ מַשְׁכֵיהּ עַד דְּאַמְטְיֵיהּ לְאֶרֶץ פְּלִשְׁתִּים כִּדְחַזְיֵיהּ יִשְׁבִּי בְּנוֹב אֲמַר הַיְינוּ הַאי דְּקַטְלֵיהּ לְגׇלְיָת אֲחִי כַּפְתֵיהּ קַמְטֵיהּ אוֹתְבֵיהּ וְשַׁדְיֵיהּ תּוּתֵי בֵּי (בַּדְיָיא) [סַדְיָיא] אִתְעֲבִיד לֵיהּ נִיסָּא מָכָא לֵיהּ אַרְעָא מִתּוּתֵיהּ הַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב תַּרְחִיב צַעֲדִי תַחְתָּי וְלֹא מָעֲדוּ קַרְסֻלָּי
human_translation: One day went to hunt a falcon [ liskor bazzai ]. Satan came and appeared to him as a deer. He shot an arrow at and did not reach it. led until he reached the land of the Philistines. When Ishbibenob saw he said: This is that who killed Goliath, my brother. He bound him, doubled him over, and placed him and cast him under of an olive press A miracle was performed for him, and the earth opened beneath him That is which is written: “You have enlarged my steps beneath me, that my feet did not slip”
llm_translation: One day he went out to hire laborers. Satan came and appeared to him as a young man. He took a saw and did not find a place to use it until he reached the land of the Philistines. When he saw it, he sat in Nob. He said, "This is the one who killed Goliath, my brother. He took his sword, killed him, cut off his head, and removed his armor. He brought it and placed it in the house of (Badya) Sadya. A miracle was done for him; the earth swallowed his blood. This is what is written, 'You have enlarged my steps under me, and my feet have not slipped.'"

hebrew_text: הָהוּא יוֹמָא אַפַּנְיָא דְּמַעֲלֵי שַׁבְּתָא הֲוָה אֲבִישַׁי בֶּן צְרוּיָה הֲוָה קָא חָיֵיף רֵישֵׁיהּ בְּאַרְבְּעָא גַּרְבֵי דְּמַיָּא חֲזִינְהוּ כִּתְמֵי דְּמָא אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי אֲתָא יוֹנָה אִיטְּרִיף קַמֵּיהּ אֲמַר כְּנֶסֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל לְיוֹנָה אִימְּתִילָא שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר 'כַּנְפֵי יוֹנָה נֶחְפָּה בַכֶּסֶף' שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ דָּוִד מַלְכָּא דְּיִשְׂרָאֵל בְּצַעֲרָא שְׁרֵי אֲתָא לְבֵיתֵיהּ וְלָא אַשְׁכְּחֵיהּ אֲמַר תְּנַן 'אֵין רוֹכְבִין עַל סוּסוֹ וְאֵין יוֹשְׁבִין עַל כִּסְאוֹ וְאֵין מִשְׁתַּמְּשִׁין בְּשַׁרְבִיטוֹ' בִּשְׁעַת הַסַּכָּנָה מַאי אֲתָא שְׁאֵיל בֵּי מִדְרְשָׁא אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ בִּשְׁעַת הַסַּכָּנָה שַׁפִּיר דָּמֵי
human_translation: That day at dusk on Shabbat eve, Abishai ben Zeruiah shampooed his hair with four jugs of water He saw four bloodstains. There are who say: A dove came and fluttered before him. said: The congregation of Israel is likened to a dove, as it is stated: “You shall shine as the wings of a dove covered with silver conclude from it David, king of Israel, is in a state of distress. He came to house and did not find him. said we learned One may not ride on horse, and one may not sit on his throne, and one may not use his scepter. In a period of danger, what He came asked the study hall They said to him: In a period of danger well
llm_translation: On that day before Shabbat, Avishai son of Tzruya was sitting and weaving a crown of four rows of precious stones. He saw that the blood was like the appearance of doves. Some say that a dove came and pecked before him. He said, "Congregation of Israel, to the dove I will liken, as it is said, 'The wings of a dove are covered with silver.' Learn from it that when King David of Israel was in distress, he would come to his house and not forget it. It is taught: 'One should not ride on his horse, nor sit on his throne, nor use his scepter in a time of danger.' What should one do in a time of danger? Seek the House of Study. They said to him, 'In a time of danger, it is proper to shed blood.'

hebrew_text: רַכְבֵיהּ לְפִרְדֵּיהּ וְקָם וַאֲזַל קְפַצָה לֵיהּ אַרְעָא בַּהֲדֵי דְּקָא מְסַגֵּי חַזְיַיהּ לְעׇרְפָּה אִמֵּיהּ דַּהֲווֹת נָוְולָא כִּי חֲזֵיתֵיהּ פְּסַקְתֵּהּ לְפִילְכַּהּ שְׁדָתֵיהּ עִילָּוֵיהּ סְבַרָא לְמִקְטְלֵיהּ אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ עֻלֵם אַיְיתִי לִי פְּלַךְ פַּתְקֵיהּ בְּרֵישׁ מוֹחַהּ וְקַטְלַהּ
human_translation: He mounted mule and arose and went The land contracted for him As he was progressing he saw Orpah, mother, spinning When she saw him, she removed her spindle and threw it at him, intending to kill she said to Young man, bring me spindle. He threw at the top of her brain and killed her.
llm_translation: His chariot to his horses and he arose and went, the earth beneath him split open, as he was reaching to see his mother's nakedness, who was lying naked when he saw her, he cut off his male organ, she thought to kill him, she said to him, "You have brought me to disgrace," she took his garment, wiped it on her private parts, and killed him.

hebrew_text: כַּד חַזְיֵיהּ יִשְׁבִּי בְּנוֹב אֲמַר הַשְׁתָּא הָווּ בֵּי תְרֵין וְקָטְלִין לִי פַּתְקֵיהּ לְדָוִד לְעֵילָּא וְדָץ לֵיהּ לְרוּמְחֵיהּ אֲמַר נִיפּוֹל עֲלֵהּ וְנִקְּטַל אֲמַר אֲבִישַׁי שֵׁם אוֹקְמֵיהּ לְדָוִד בֵּין שְׁמַיָּא לְאַרְעָא
human_translation: When Ishbibenob saw him, he said: Now they are two, and they will kill me. He threw David up and stuck his spear He said: Let fall upon it and die. Abishai recited name suspended David between heaven and earth
llm_translation: As his eyes beheld, Yishbi in Nob said, "Now the sons of two men were there, and they killed his writings for David above, and they crushed them for him into the depths." He said, "Let him fall upon it and be killed." Avishai said, "The name shall be established for David between heaven and earth."

hebrew_text: וְנֵימָא לֵיהּ אִיהוּ אֵין חָבוּשׁ מוֹצִיא עַצְמוֹ מִבֵּית הָאֲסוּרִין
human_translation: And let himself recite A prisoner does not release himself from a prison
llm_translation: And it was said about him: "A prisoner cannot release himself from prison."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ מַאי בָּעֵית הָכָא אֲמַר לֵיהּ הָכִי אֲמַר לִי קוּדְשָׁא בְּרִיךְ הוּא וְהָכִי אַהְדַּרִי לֵיהּ אֲמַר לֵיהּ אֵפֹיךְ צְלוֹתָיךְ בַּר בְּרָךְ קִירָא לִיזְבּוֹן וְאַתְּ לָא תִּצְטַעַר
human_translation: said to What do you seek here said to him: This the Holy One, Blessed be He, said to me, and this I responded to Him; said to him: Reverse your prayer Let your son’s son sell wax, and you will not suffer.
llm_translation: He said to him, "What do you need here?" He said to him, "This is what the Holy One, blessed be He, said to me, and thus I must return it to Him." He said to him, "Go, immerse your bread in salt, and you will not be harmed."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אִי הָכִי סַיַּיע בַּהֲדַן הַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב וַיַּעֲזׇר לוֹ אֲבִישַׁי בֶּן צְרוּיָה אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב שֶׁעֲזָרוֹ בִּתְפִלָּה אֲמַר אֲבִישַׁי שֵׁם וְאַחֲתֵיהּ
human_translation: said to him: If so, help me. That is which is written: “And Abishai, son of Zeruiah, came to his aid, Rav Yehuda says Rav says: that he came to his aid in prayer. Abishai recited name and caused land
llm_translation: He said to him: If so, it is consistent with what we have learned, as it is written, "And Abishai the son of Zeruiah helped him." Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: His help was through prayer. Abishai said: "Shem and his sister."

hebrew_text: הֲוָה קָא רָדֵיף בָּתְרַיְיהוּ כִּי מְטֹא קוּבֵּי אָמְרִי קוּם בֵּיהּ כִּי מְטֹא בֵּי תְרֵי אָמְרִי בִּתְרֵי גּוּרְיָוָן קַטְלוּהּ לְאַרְיָא אָמְרִי לֵיהּ זִיל אִשְׁתְּכַח לְעׇרְפָּה אִימָּיךְ בְּקִיבְרָא כִּי אַדְכַּרוּ לֵיהּ שְׁמָא דְּאִימֵּיהּ כְּחַשׁ חֵילֵיהּ וְקַטְלוּהּ הַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב אָז נִשְׁבְּעוּ אַנְשֵׁי דָוִד לוֹ לֵאמֹר לֹא תֵצֵא עוֹד אִתָּנוּ לַמִּלְחָמָה וְלֹא תְכַבֶּה אֶת נֵר יִשְׂרָאֵל
human_translation: pursued them, When they reached Kuvi they said: Stand against him [ kum beih ]. When they reached Bei Terei, said: With two [ bitrei ] cubs they killed the lion, They said to Go find Orpah, your mother, in the grave. When they mentioned his mother’s name to him his strength diminished, and they killed him. It is that it is written: “Then David’s men took an oath to him saying: You shall not go with us to war anymore and you will not douse the lamp of Israel”
llm_translation: He was pursuing after them, when they reached a cave. They said, "Arise, go into it." When they reached the second cave, they said, "In the second den of lions they killed her." They said to him, "Go, find her in the grave, for perhaps her mother's name was inscribed on her body, and they killed her." This is what is written, "Then the men of David swore to him, saying, 'You shall not go out with us to battle anymore, lest you quench the lamp of Israel.'"

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן שְׁלֹשָׁה קָפְצָה לָהֶם הָאָרֶץ אֱלִיעֶזֶר עֶבֶד אַבְרָהָם וְיַעֲקֹב אָבִינוּ וַאֲבִישַׁי בֶּן צְרוּיָה אֲבִישַׁי בֶּן צְרוּיָה הָא דַּאֲמַרַן אֱלִיעֶזֶר עֶבֶד אַבְרָהָם דִּכְתִיב וָאָבֹא הַיּוֹם אֶל הָעָיִן לְמֵימְרָא דְּהָהוּא יוֹמָא נְפַק יַעֲקֹב אָבִינוּ
human_translation: The Sages taught For three the land contracted, Eliezer, servant of Abraham, and Jacob our forefather, and Abishai, son of Zeruiah. Abishai, son of Zeruiah, that which we said. Eliezer, servant of Abraham, as it is written: “And I came that day to the well” to say that on that day he left Jacob our forefather
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: Three individuals the land rejected - Eliezer the servant of Abraham, our father Jacob, and Abishai son of Zeruiah. Regarding Abishai son of Zeruiah, as we said, Eliezer the servant of Abraham, as it is written, "And I came today to the spring" - to say the words of that day, Jacob our father went out.

hebrew_text: דִּכְתִיב וַיֵּצֵא יַעֲקֹב מִבְּאֵר שָׁבַע וַיֵּלֶךְ חָרָנָה וּכְתִיב וַיִּפְגַּע בַּמָּקוֹם וַיָּלֶן שָׁם כִּי בָא הַשֶּׁמֶשׁ כִּי מְטָא לְחָרָן אֲמַר אֶפְשָׁר עָבַרְתִּי עַל מְקוֹם שֶׁהִתְפַּלְּלוּ בּוֹ אֲבוֹתַי וַאֲנִי לֹא הִתְפַּלַּלְתִּי בּוֹ בָּעֵי לְמֶיהְדַּר כֵּיוָן דְּהַרְהַר בְּדַעְתֵּיהּ לְמִיהְדַּר קְפַצָה לֵיהּ אַרְעָא מִיָּד וַיִּפְגַּע בַּמָּקוֹם
human_translation: as it is written: “And Jacob departed from Beersheba and went to Haran” and it is written “And he encountered [ vayyifga ] the place, and he slept there, for the sun had set” when arrived at Haran, he said: Is it possible that I bypassed a place where my forefathers prayed and I did not pray there? He sought to return Once he contemplated in his mind to return, the land contracted for him, immediately: “And he encountered the place,”
llm_translation: It is written: "And Jacob went out from Beersheba and went to Haran." And it is written: "And he encountered the place and spent the night there because the sun had set, and he took from the stones of the place, and he placed them around his head, and he lay down in that place." When the sun rose, he said, "Perhaps I passed over a place where my forefathers prayed, and I did not pray there. I desire to return to it." As soon as he resolved to return, the land leaped towards him, and he encountered the place.

hebrew_text: דָּבָר אַחֵר אֵין פְּגִיעָה אֶלָּא תְּפִלָּה שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וְאַתָּה אַל תִּתְפַּלֵּל בְּעַד הָעָם הַזֶּה וְאַל תִּשָּׂא בַעֲדָם רִנָּה וּתְפִלָּה וְאַל תִּפְגַּע בִּי
human_translation: Alternatively, encounter nothing other than prayer, as it is stated: “And you, do not pray on behalf of this nation, and do not raise on their behalf song and prayer, and do not encounter [ tifga ] Me,
llm_translation: Another matter: Intercession is nothing but prayer, as it is stated, "And you, do not pray for this people, and do not lift up for them a cry or prayer, and do not intercede with Me."

hebrew_text: וַיָּלֶן שָׁם כִּי בָא הַשֶּׁמֶשׁ בָּתַר דְּצַלִּי בָּעֵי לְמִיהְדַּר אָמַר הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא צַדִּיק זֶה בָּא לְבֵית מְלוֹנִי יִפָּטֵר בְּלֹא לִינָה מִיָּד בָּא הַשֶּׁמֶשׁ וְהַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב וַיִּזְרַח לוֹ הַשֶּׁמֶשׁ וְכִי לוֹ בִּלְבַד זָרְחָה וַהֲלֹא לְכׇל הָעוֹלָם כּוּלּוֹ זָרְחָה אֶלָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק שֶׁמֶשׁ שֶׁבָּאָה בַּעֲבוּרוֹ זָרְחָה בַּעֲבוּרוֹ
human_translation: “And he slept there because the sun had set” After prayed he sought to return the Holy One, Blessed be He, said: This righteous came to My inn. Will him to take leave without sleeping Immediately the sun set, and that is which is written “And the sun shone for him And did shine only for him? But didn’t shine for the entire world? Rather, Rabbi Yitzḥak says: The sun that set for him shone for him
llm_translation: And he lodged there because the sun had set; he did not want to lodge in the city. He said, "This righteous one came to my inn; he will depart without lodging." Immediately the sun set, as it is written, "And the sun shone for him." And was it only for him that it shone? Did it not shine for the whole world? Rather, Rabbi Yitzchak said, "The sun that came for his sake, shone for his sake."

hebrew_text: וּמְנָלַן דִּכְלָה זַרְעֵיהּ דְּדָוִד  דִּכְתִיב וַעֲתַלְיָה אֵם אֲחַזְיָהוּ רָאֲתָה כִּי מֵת בְּנָהּ וַתָּקׇם וַתְּאַבֵּד אֵת כׇּל זֶרַע הַמַּמְלָכָה וְהָא אִשְׁתְּיַיר לֵיהּ יוֹאָשׁ הָתָם נָמֵי אִשְׁתְּיַיר אֶבְיָתָר דִּכְתִיב וַיִּמָּלֵט בֵּן אֶחָד לַאֲחִימֶלֶךְ בֶּן אֲחִטוּב וּשְׁמוֹ אֶבְיָתָר אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב אִלְמָלֵא לֹא נִשְׁתַּיֵּיר אֶבְיָתָר לַאֲחִימֶלֶךְ בֶּן אֲחִיטוּב לֹא נִשְׁתַּיֵּיר מִזַּרְעוֹ שֶׁל דָּוִד שָׂרִיד וּפָלִיט
human_translation: And from where do we that David’s descendants ceased as it is stated: “And Athaliah the mother of Ahaziah saw that her son was dead, and she arose and destroyed all the royal descendants” But didn’t Joash remain There too, Abiathar, remained as it is written: “And one of the sons of Ahimelech, son of Ahitub, named Abiathar, escaped” Rav Yehuda says Rav says: Were it not for Abiathar remained for Ahimelech, son of Ahitub, there would have been no remnant or refugee remaining from the descendants of David.
llm_translation: And from where do we know that the seed of David will cease? As it is written, "And Athaliah the mother of Ahaziah saw that her son was dead, and she arose and destroyed all the seed royal." And yet Joash remained, for it is written, "And he was with them hid in the house of God six years; and Athaliah reigned over the land." Thereafter, it is written, "And one of the sons of Ahimelech the son of Ahitub, whose name was Abiathar, escaped and fled after David." Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav, "If Abiathar had not remained with Ahimelech the son of Ahitub, there would not have remained any survivor or fugitive from the seed of David."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב בָּא עֲלֵיהֶם סַנְחֵרִיב הָרָשָׁע בְּאַרְבָּעִים וַחֲמִשָּׁה אֶלֶף אִישׁ בְּנֵי מְלָכִים יוֹשְׁבִים בִּקְרוֹנוֹת שֶׁל זָהָב וְעִמָּהֶן שִׁגְלוֹנוֹת וְזוֹנוֹת וּבִשְׁמֹנִים אֶלֶף גִּבּוֹרִים לְבוּשֵׁי שִׁרְיוֹן קְלִיפָּה וּבְשִׁשִּׁים אֶלֶף אֲחוּזֵי חֶרֶב רָצִים לְפָנָיו וְהַשְּׁאָר פָּרָשִׁים וְכֵן בָּאוּ עַל אַבְרָהָם וְכֵן עֲתִידִין לָבוֹא עִם גּוֹג וּמָגוֹג
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Rav says: Sennacherib the wicked came upon them with forty-five thousand men, sons of kings, sitting in carriages of gold, and with them consorts and prostitutes, and with eighty thousand warriors wearing a coat of mail, and with sixty thousand sword-bearers running before him, and the rest were cavalry. And likewise, came upon Abraham And likewise, are destined to come with Gog and Magog
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: Sancheriv, the wicked, came upon them with forty-five thousand men, sons of kings, sitting on thrones of gold. With them were harlots, concubines, and eighty thousand warriors dressed in silk garments. And with sixty thousand armed horsemen running before him, and the rest were horsemen. And so they came upon Avraham, and so they are destined to come with Gog and Magog.

hebrew_text: בְּמַתְנִיתָא תָּנָא אוֹרֶךְ מַחֲנֵהוּ אַרְבַּע מֵאוֹת פַּרְסָה רֹחַב צַוַּאר סוּסָיו אַרְבָּעִים פַּרְסָה סַךְ מַחֲנֵהוּ מָאתַיִם וְשִׁשִּׁים רִיבּוֹא אֲלָפִים חָסֵר חַד בָּעֵי אַבָּיֵי חָסֵר חַד רִיבּוֹיָא אוֹ חָסַר חַד אַלְפָּא אוֹ חָסַר מְאָה אוֹ חָסַר חַד תֵּיקוּ
human_translation: was taught in a baraita : The length of the camp was four hundred parasangs and the width of the necks of his horses was forty parasangs. total his camp was 260 ten thousands, minus one. Abaye asks: minus one ten thousand, or minus one one thousand, or minus one one hundred or minus one? shall stand
llm_translation: In the Mishnah it was taught: The length of his camp was four hundred parasangs, the width of the necks of his horses forty parasangs. The total of his camp was two hundred and sixty thousand myriads, lacking one. Abaye requires one myriad, or requires one ribbuya, or requires one thousand, or requires one hundred, or requires one. Well said!

hebrew_text: תָּנָא רִאשׁוֹנִים עָבְרוּ בִּשְׂחִי שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר 'וְחָלַף בִּיהוּדָה שָׁטַף וְעָבַר' אֶמְצָעִיִּים עָבְרוּ בְּקוֹמָה שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר 'עַד צַוָּאר יַגִּיעַ' אַחֲרוֹנִים הֶעֱלוּ עָפָר בְּרַגְלֵיהֶם וְלֹא מָצְאוּ מַיִם בַּנָּהָר לִשְׁתּוֹת עַד שֶׁהֵבִיאוּ מַיִם מִמָּקוֹם אַחֵר וְשָׁתוּ שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר 'אֲנִי קַרְתִּי וְשָׁתִיתִי מָיִם' וְגוֹ'
human_translation: taught: The first crossed by swimming as it is stated: “And he shall sweep through Judea; he shall overflow and pass” the middle passed while standing upright, as it is stated: “It shall reach even the neck” The last kicked up dust with their feet, and they did not find water in the river to drink, until they brought water from another place and drank as it is stated: “I dug and drank water”
llm_translation: The early ones passed through the thorns, as it is stated, "And he passed through Judah, he overflowed and passed through." The middle ones passed through the height, as it is stated, "Until the neck he will reach." The later ones raised dust with their feet and did not find water in the river to drink until they brought water from another place and drank, as it is stated, "I dug and drank water," etc.

hebrew_text: וְהָכְתִיב וַיֵּצֵא מַלְאַךְ ה' וַיַּכֶּה בְּמַחֲנֵה אַשּׁוּר מֵאָה וּשְׁמוֹנִים וַחֲמִשָּׁה אָלֶף (וַיָּקוּמוּ) [וַיַּשְׁכִּימוּ] בַבֹּקֶר וְהִנֵּה כֻלָּם פְּגָרִים מֵתִים אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ הַלָּלוּ רָאשֵׁי גְיָיסוֹת הֵן
human_translation: But isn’t it written: “Then the angel of the Lord went forth and smote in the camp of the Assyrians one hundred and eighty-five thousand. And when they arose early in the morning, behold, they were all dead corpses” Rabbi Abbahu says: These are regiment leaders,
llm_translation: And it is written, "And the angel of the Lord went out and struck down in the camp of Assyria one hundred and eighty-five thousand (and they arose) and they arose in the morning, and behold, they were all dead bodies." Rabbi Abbahu said, "These are the officers of the armies."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי דַּיְקָא נָמֵי דִּכְתִיב בְּמִשְׁמַנָּיו רָזוֹן בִּשְׁמֵינִים דְּאִית בְּהוּ אָמַר רָבִינָא דַּיְקָא נָמֵי דִּכְתִיב וַיִּשְׁלַח ה' מַלְאָךְ וַיַּכְחֵד כׇּל גִּבּוֹר חַיִל וְנָגִיד וְשָׂר בְּמַחֲנֵה וְגוֹ' וַיָּבֹא בֵּית אֱלֹהָיו וּמִיצִיאֵי מֵעָיו שָׁם הִפִּילֻהוּ בֶחָרֶב שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ
human_translation: Rav Ashi says: It is also precise as it is written: among his fat ones leanness” the fat, among them Ravina says: is also precise as it is written: “And the Lord sent an angel, who obliterated the mighty men-at-arms and the leaders and captains in the camp And when he came into the house of his God, his own offspring slew him there with a sword” Conclude from it
llm_translation: Rav Ashei said: Precisely as it is written in his anointing oil is delight in the heavens, that is in it. Ravina said: Precisely as it is written, "And the Lord sent an angel, who cut down every mighty warrior, leader, and officer in the camp, etc." And he came to the house of his God, and there they cast him down with the sword. Learn from this.

hebrew_text: בַּמֶּה הִכָּם רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר בַּיָּד הִכָּם שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וַיַּרְא יִשְׂרָאֵל אֶת הַיָּד הַגְּדֹלָה הַיָּד שֶׁעֲתִידָה לִיפָּרַע מִסַּנְחֵרִיב רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר בְּאֶצְבַּע הִכָּם שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וַיֹּאמְרוּ הַחַרְטֻמִּים אֶל פַּרְעֹה אֶצְבַּע אֱלֹהִים הִיא הִיא אֶצְבַּע שֶׁעֲתִידָה לִיפָּרַע מִסַּנְחֵרִיב רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בְּנוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי אוֹמֵר אָמַר לוֹ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לְגַבְרִיאֵל מַגָּלְךָ נְטוּשָׁה אָמַר לְפָנָיו רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם נְטוּשָׁה וְעוֹמֶדֶת מִשֵּׁשֶׁת יְמֵי בְּרֵאשִׁית שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר 'מִפְּנֵי חֲרָבוֹת נָדָדוּ'
human_translation: With what strike them? Rabbi Eliezer says: He struck them by hand, as it is stated: “And Israel saw the great hand” the hand that was destined to exact retribution from Sennacherib. Rabbi Yehoshua says: He struck them with finger, as it is stated: “And the sorcerers said to Pharaoh: This is the finger of God” indicating it is finger that was destined to exact retribution from Sennacherib. Rabbi Eliezer, son of Rabbi Yosei HaGelili, says the Holy One, Blessed be He, said to Gabriel: your scythe honed? said before Him: Master of the Universe, it is standing honed from the six days of Creation, as it is stated: “For they have fled from the swords,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: With what did Rabbi Eliezer strike? He says, "With the hand he struck, as it is said, 'And Israel saw the great hand,' the hand that is destined to take revenge from Sancheirev." Rabbi Yehoshua says, "With the finger he struck, as it is said, 'And the magicians said to Pharaoh, 'This is the finger of God,' the finger that is destined to take revenge from Sancheirev." Rabbi Eliezer, son of Rabbi Yosei the Galilean, says, "The Holy One, blessed be He, said to Gabriel, 'Your netushah is revealed.' He said before Him, 'Master of the Universe, she is revealed and standing from the six days of Creation,' as it is said, 'Because of the swords they wandered.'"

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַי אוֹמֵר אוֹתוֹ הַפֶּרֶק זְמַן בִּישּׁוּל פֵּירוֹת הָיָה אָמַר לוֹ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לְגַבְרִיאֵל 'כְּשֶׁאַתָּה יוֹצֵא לְבַשֵּׁל פֵּירוֹת  הִזָּקֵק לָהֶם' שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר 'מִדֵּי עׇבְרוֹ יִקַּח אֶתְכֶם כִּי בַבֹּקֶר בַּבֹּקֶר יַעֲבֹר בַּיּוֹם וּבַלָּיְלָה וְהָיָה רַק זְוָעָה הָבִין שְׁמוּעָה' וְגוֹ' אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא הַיְינוּ דְּאָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי אַגַּב אוֹרְחָךְ לִבְעֵל דְּבָבָךְ אִישְׁתְּמַע
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai says: That period was the season of the ripening of the fruit. The Holy One, Blessed be He, said to Gabriel: When you emerge to ripen fruits, attend to them, as it is stated: “As often as it passes through, it shall take you; for morning by morning shall it pass through, by day and by night; and the mere understanding of the report shall bring terror” Rav Pappa says this that people say: While on your path, appear before your enemy
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai says: That same chapter, the time of the ripening of fruits, the Holy One, blessed be He, said to Gabriel, "When you go out to cook fruits, inspect them," as it is stated, "He will take you away because of your transgression. He will pass by you every morning, pass by you by day and by night, and it will be only terror to understand the report." So Rav Papa said: This is what people say, "Regarding the path to your husband's beehive, be cautious."

hebrew_text: וְיֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים בְּחוֹטְמָן נָשַׁף בָּהֶן וָמֵתוּ שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וְגַם נָשַׁף בָּהֶם וַיִּבָשׁוּ רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר כַּפַּיִים סָפַק לָהֶם וָמֵתוּ שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וְגַם אֲנִי (הִכֵּתִי) [אַכֶּה] כַפִּי אֶל כַּפִּי וַהֲנִחֹתִי חֲמָתִי רַבִּי יִצְחָק נַפָּחָא אָמַר אׇזְנַיִם גָּלָה לָהֶם וְשָׁמְעוּ שִׁירָה מִפִּי חַיּוֹת וָמֵתוּ שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר מֵרוֹמְמֻתֶךָ נָפְצוּ גּוֹיִם
human_translation: And there are those who say: blew into through their noses and they died, as it is stated: “When he blows upon them, and they wither” Rabbi Yirmeya bar Abba says: clapped his hands to them and they died, as it is stated: “I will also strike My hands together and I will assuage My anger” Rabbi Yitzḥak Nappaḥa says: He revealed ears for them and they hear the songs from the mouths of the creatures and they died, as it is stated: “From Your exaltation the nations were scattered”
llm_translation: And some say, in the case of a sorcerer who practiced sorcery with them and they died, as it is said, "And they also practiced sorcery with them, and they became ashamed." Rabbi Yirmiyah bar Abba said, "He clapped his hands at them, and they died, as it is said, 'And I also (have clapped) will strike my hands together, and I will satisfy my fury.'" Rabbi Yitzchak Nappacha said, "He uncovered their ears, and they heard a song from the mouth of living creatures, and they died, as it is said, 'From your exalted place, nations were scattered.'"

hebrew_text: וְכַמָּה נִשְׁתַּיֵּיר מֵהֶם רַב אָמַר עֲשָׂרָה שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וּשְׁאָר עֵץ יַעְרוֹ מִסְפָּר יִהְיוּ וְנַעַר יִכְתְּבֵם כַּמָּה נַעַר יָכוֹל לִכְתּוֹב  עֲשָׂרָה וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר תִּשְׁעָה שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וְנִשְׁאַר בּוֹ עוֹלֵלֹת כְּנֹקֶף זַיִת שְׁנַיִם שְׁלֹשָׁה גַּרְגְּרִים בְּרֹאשׁ אָמִיר אַרְבָּעָה חֲמִשָּׁה בִּסְעִפֶיהָ
human_translation: And how many of remained Rav says: Ten as it is stated: “And the rest of the trees of his forest shall be few, that a child may write them” And what number can a child write? ten, And Shmuel says: Nine as it is stated: “And gleanings shall be left of him, as in the beating of an olive tree, two or three berries in the top of the uppermost bough, four or five in the branches of a fruitful tree”
llm_translation: And how many are left of them? Rav said ten, as it is stated, "And the remaining trees of his forest will be so few that a child could write them down." How many trees can a child write? Ten. And Shmuel said nine, as it is stated, "And if there remain ten men in one house, they shall die." Two, three, four, five, in its branches.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי אָמַר אַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר שְׁנַיִם שְׁלֹשָׁה [וְכוּ'] אַרְבָּעָה וַחֲמִשָּׁה רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר חֲמִשָּׁה סַנְחֵרִיב וּשְׁנֵי בָּנָיו נְבוּכַדְנֶצַּר וּנְבוּזַּר־אֲדָן נְבוּזַרְאֲדָן גְּמָרָא נְבוּכַדְנֶצַּר דִּכְתִיב וְרֵוֵהּ דִּי רְבִיעָאָה דָּמֵה לְבַר אֱלָהִין וְאִי לָאו דְּחַזְיֵיהּ מְנָא הֲוָה יָדַע סַנְחֵרִיב וּשְׁנֵי בָּנָיו דִּכְתִיב וַיְהִי הוּא מִשְׁתַּחֲוֶה בֵּית נִסְרֹךְ אֱלֹהָיו וְאַדְרַמֶּלֶךְ וְשַׂרְאֶצֶר בָּנָיו הִכֻּהוּ בַחֶרֶב
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi says: Fourteen as it is stated: “Two or three…four or five,” Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Five Sennacherib, and his two sons, Nebuchadnezzar, and Nebuzaradan, Nebuzaradan tradition. Nebuchadnezzar as it is written “And the appearance of the fourth is like that of an angel” And if he had not seen from where would he have known Sennacherib and his two sons as it is written “And it came to pass as he was worshipping in the house of Nisroch his god that Adrammelech and Sarezer, his sons, smote him with the sword”
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: Fourteen, as it is stated, "Two, three and so on four and five." Rabbi Yochanan said: Five. Sancheiriv and his two sons, Nebuchadnezzar and Nebuzaradan. Nebuzaradan is Nebuchadnezzar, as it is written, "And his appearance was like that of a god." And if not, how did he know? Sancheiriv and his two sons, as it is written, "And it came to pass, as he was worshipping in the house of Nisroch his god, that Adrammelech and Sharezer his sons smote him with the sword."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ אִלְמָלֵא מִקְרָא כָּתוּב אִי אֶפְשָׁר לְאׇמְרוֹ דִּכְתִיב בַּיּוֹם הַהוּא יְגַלַּח ה' בְּתַעַר הַשְּׂכִירָה בְּעֶבְרֵי נָהָר בְּמֶלֶךְ אַשּׁוּר אֶת הָרֹאשׁ וְשַׂעַר הָרַגְלָיִם וְגַם אֶת הַזָּקָן תִּסְפֶּה
human_translation: Rabbi Abbahu says: Were the verse not written, it impossible to say it, as it is written: “On that day shall the Lord shave with a hired razor in the parts beyond the river the king of Assyria, the head, and the hair of the legs, and it shall also sweep away the beard”
llm_translation: Rabbi Avahu said: Were it not for the verse written, it would be impossible to say it, as it is written: "On that day, the Lord will shave with a hired razor, with those beyond the River, with the king of Assyria, the head and the hair of the legs, and also the beard He will remove."

hebrew_text: אֲתָא קוּדְשָׁא בְּרִיךְ הוּא וְאִדְּמִי לֵיהּ כְּגַבְרָא סָבָא אֲמַר לֵיהּ כִּי אָזְלַתְּ לְגַבֵּי מַלְכֵי מִזְרָח וּמַעֲרָב דְּאַיְיתִיתִינְהוּ לִבְנַיְיהוּ וּקְטַלְתִּינְהוּ מַאי אָמְרַתְּ לְהוּ אֲמַר לֵיהּ הַהוּא גַּבְרָא בְּהָהוּא פַּחְדָּא נָמֵי יָתֵיב אֲמַר לֵיהּ הֵיכִי נַעֲבֵיד אֲמַר לֵיהּ זִיל
human_translation: The Holy One, Blessed be He, came and appeared to as an old man. said to him: When you go to the kings of the east and the west whose children you brought and killed, what will you say to them? said to That man, also sits with the same fear, said to What should we do? said to him: Go
llm_translation: The Holy One, blessed be He, came and appeared to him like an elderly man. He said to him, "When you went before the kings of the East and the West, what did you bring to them and what did you tell them?" He said to him, "That man, in that place, was sitting in awe." He said to him, "What should we do?" He said to him, "Go."

hebrew_text: וְשַׁנִּי נַפְשָׁךְ בְּמַאי אֵישַׁנֵּי אֲמַר לֵיהּ זִיל אַיְיתִי לִי מַסְפְּרָא וְאֶיגְזְיָיךְ אֲנָא מֵהֵיכָא אַיְיתֵי אֲמַר לֵיהּ עוּל לְהָהוּא בֵּיתָא וְאַיְיתֵי אֲזַל אַשְׁכְּחִינְהוּ (אֲתוֹ) [לְ]מַלְאֲכֵי שָׁרֵת וְאִידְּמוֹ לֵיהּ כְּגַבְרֵי וַהֲווֹ קָא טָחֲנִי קַשְׁיָיתָא
human_translation: and change your With what shall I change said to him: Go bring me scissors and I will shear you From where should I bring said to him: Go to that house and bring He went found ministering angels, came and appeared to as men; and were grinding date pits.
llm_translation: And repeat your question with what? He said to him, "Go, bring me a knife, and I will cut you." From where do I bring it? He said to him, "Go to that house and bring it." He went, found them the angels like men, grinding barley.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לְהוּ הַבוּ לִי מַסְפְּרָא אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ טְחוֹן חַד גְּרִיוָא דְּקַשְׁיָיתָא וְנִיתֵּן לָךְ טְחַן חַד גְּרִיוָא דְּקַשְׁיָיתָא וִיהַבוּ לֵיהּ מַסְפַּרְתָּא עַד דַּאֲתָא אִיחֲשַׁךְ אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ זִיל אַיְיתִי נוּרָא אֲזַל וְאַיְיתִי נוּרָא בַּהֲדֵי דְּקָא נָפַח לֵיהּ אִתְּלִי בֵּיהּ נוּרָא בְּדִיקְנֵיהּ אֲזַל גַּזְיֵיהּ לְרֵישֵׁיהּ וְדִיקְנֵיהּ (אֲמַרוּ) הַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב וְגַם אֶת הַזָּקָן תִּסְפֶּה אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא הַיְינוּ דְּאָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי גָּרֵירְתֵּיהּ לְאַרְמָאָה שְׁפַר לֵיהּ אַיתְלֵי לֵיהּ נוּרָא בְּדִיקְנֵיהּ וְלָא שָׂבְעַתְּ חוּכָא מִינֵּיהּ
human_translation: said to them: Give me scissors. said to him: Grind a se’a of pits and we will give to you. He ground a se’a of pits and they gave him scissors. By he came it grew dark. said to Go bring fire went and brought fire. While he was fanning it, the fire ignited his beard it spread sheared his head and his beard. said: This is which is written: “And it shall also destroy the beard” Rav Pappa says this that people say: If you scorch a gentile it is pleasant for him, ignite a fire in his beard and you will never tire of ridiculing him.
llm_translation: He said to them, "Give me a knife." They said to him, "Grind one barley grain of the hardest kind, and we will give you a knife." He ground one barley grain of the hardest kind, and they gave him the knife. Until Hishak came, they said to him, "Go, bring fire." He went and brought fire, and as he was blowing on it, the flame flared up towards him. He placed the fire on his head and blew on it. They said, "This is what is written: 'And also the old man shall be covered over.'" Rav Papa said, "This is what people say: 'His Aramaic is dragging him down.' It would have been better for him to place the fire on his head and not satisfy his craving."

hebrew_text: אֲזַל אַשְׁכַּח דַּפָּא מִתֵּיבוּתָא דְּנֹחַ אָמַר הַיְינוּ אֱלָהָא רַבָּא דְּשֵׁיזְבֵיהּ לְנֹחַ מִטּוֹפָנָא אֲמַר אִי אָזֵיל הָהוּא גַּבְרָא וּמַצְלַח מְקָרֵב לְהוּ לִתְרֵין בְּנוֹהִי קַמָּךְ שְׁמַעוּ בְּנוֹהִי וְקַטְלוּהּ הַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב וַיְהִי הוּא מִשְׁתַּחֲוֶה בֵּית נִסְרֹךְ אֱלֹהָיו וְאַדְרַמֶּלֶךְ וְשַׂרְאֶצֶר בָּנָיו הִכֻּהוּ בַחֶרֶב וְגוֹ'
human_translation: went and found a beam from Noah’s ark, He said: This is the great god who delivered Noah from the flood. He said: If that man, goes and succeeds, he will sacrifice his two sons before you. His sons heard and killed him. This is which is written: “And it came to pass as he was worshipping in the house of Nisroch his god that Adrammelech and Sarezer, his sons, smote him with the sword,
llm_translation: He went and found a parchment from the school of Noah. He said, "This is the great God who made a covenant with Noah from the top." He said, "If I go to that man and succeed in bringing him close, two of his sons will stand against you, listen to his sons, and kill him." This is as it is written, "And it came to pass, as he was worshiping in the house of Nisroch his god, that Adrammelech and Sharezer his sons smote him with the sword, etc."

hebrew_text: וַיֵּחָלֵק עֲלֵיהֶם לַיְלָה הוּא וַעֲבָדָיו וַיַּכֵּם וְגוֹ' אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אוֹתוֹ מַלְאָךְ שֶׁנִּזְדַּמֵּן לוֹ לְאַבְרָהָם לַיְלָה שְׁמוֹ שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וְהַלַּיְלָה אָמַר הֹרָה גָבֶר וְרַבִּי יִצְחָק נַפָּחָא אָמַר שֶׁעָשָׂה עִמּוֹ מַעֲשֵׂה לַיְלָה שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר מִן שָׁמַיִם נִלְחָמוּ הַכּוֹכָבִים מִמְּסִלּוֹתָם נִלְחֲמוּ עִם סִיסְרָא אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ טָבָא דְּנַפָּחָא מִדְּבַר נַפָּחָא
human_translation: And he divided himself against them by night [ laila ], he and his servants, and smote them” Rabbi Yoḥanan says: That angel that happened to Abraham Laila is his name, as it is stated: “And Laila said: A man-child is brought forth” And Rabbi Yitzḥak Nappaḥa says: performed for him an act of night, as it is stated: “They fought from heaven; the stars in their courses fought against Sisera” Reish Lakish said: the smith, is preferable to of the son of the smith,
llm_translation: And he divided against them by night he and his servants and struck them etc. Rabbi Yochanan said: That angel that appeared to Abraham at night, his name was as it is said, "And the night said, 'A man has prevailed.'" And Rabbi Yitzchak Napacha said: That he did with him a night act, as it is said, "From heaven the stars fought, from their courses they fought with Sisera." Reish Lakish said: Great is the night act, from the wilderness he acted.

hebrew_text: וַיִּרְדֹּף עַד דָּן אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן כֵּיוָן שֶׁבָּא אוֹתוֹ צַדִּיק עַד דָּן  תָּשַׁשׁ כֹּחוֹ רָאָה בְּנֵי בָּנָיו שֶׁעֲתִידִין לַעֲבוֹד עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה בְּדָן שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וַיָּשֶׂם אֶת הָאֶחָד בְּבֵית אֵל וְאֶת הָאֶחָד נָתַן בְּדָן וְאַף אוֹתוֹ רָשָׁע לֹא נִתְגַּבֵּר עַד שֶׁהִגִּיעַ לְדָן שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר מִדָּן נִשְׁמַע נַחְרַת סוּסָיו
human_translation: “And he pursued as far as Dan” Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Once that righteous came to Dan, his strength weakened. He saw that his descendants were destined to worship idols in Dan, as it is stated: and he set one in Bethel, and the other one he placed in Dan” And even that wicked did not prevail until he reached Dan, as it is stated: “From Dan the snorting of his horses is heard”
llm_translation: "And he pursued until Dan. Rabbi Yochanan said: Once that righteous one came to Dan, his strength weakened. He saw his grandchildren who were destined to serve foreign worship in Dan, as it is stated: 'And he placed one in Bethel and the other he put in Dan.' And even that wicked one did not prevail until he reached Dan, as it is stated: 'From Dan was heard the snorting of his horses.'"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא אַף עַל גַּב דְּשָׁלַח רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בְּתֵירָא מִנְּצִיבִין הִזָּהֲרוּ בְּזָקֵן שֶׁשָּׁכַח תַּלְמוּדוֹ מֵחֲמַת אוֹנְסוֹ וְהִזָּהֲרוּ בַּוְּורִידִין כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה וְהִזָּהֲרוּ בִּבְנֵי עַמֵּי הָאָרֶץ שֶׁמֵּהֶן תֵּצֵא תּוֹרָה כִּי הָא מִילְּתָא מוֹדְעִינַן לְהוּ
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira says: Even though Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira sent from Netzivin: Be vigilant with regard to an elder who forgot his studies due to circumstances beyond his control, and be vigilant with regard to jugular veins in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda, and be vigilant with regard to the children of ignoramuses, as from them Torah will emerge, we inform them like this matter.
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira said, even though Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira sent a message from the council of Natzivin, be cautious with an elder who forgets his learning due to his age, and be cautious with the Vuridin like Rabbi Yehuda, and be cautious with the common people, for from them Torah will emerge, as we are familiar with this matter.

hebrew_text: צַדִּיק אַתָּה ה' כִּי אָרִיב אֵלֶיךָ אַךְ מִשְׁפָּטִים אֲדַבֵּר אוֹתָךְ מַדּוּעַ דֶּרֶךְ רְשָׁעִים צָלֵחָה שָׁלוּ כׇּל בֹּגְדֵי בָגֶד נְטַעְתָּם גַּם שֹׁרָשׁוּ יֵלְכוּ גַּם עָשׂוּ פֶרִי מַאי אַהְדַּרוּ לֵיהּ כִּי אֶת רַגְלִים רַצְתָּה וַיַּלְאוּךָ וְאֵיךְ תְּתַחֲרֶה אֶת הַסּוּסִים וּבְאֶרֶץ שָׁלוֹם אַתָּה בוֹטֵחַ וְאֵיךְ תַּעֲשֶׂה בִּגְאוֹן הַיַּרְדֵּן
human_translation: “Right would you be, Lord, were I to contend with You; yet will I reason with You: Why does the path of the wicked prosper; why are all who deal treacherously secure? You have planted them, they have also taken root; they grow, they also bring forth fruit” What did they respond to “If you have run with the pedestrians, and they have wearied you, how can you contend with horses? And though in a land of peace you feel secure, how will you do in the wild country of the Jordan?”
llm_translation: Righteous are You, O Lord, when I plead with You; yet let me talk with You about Your judgments: Why does the way of the wicked prosper? Why are those happy who deal so treacherously? You have planted them, yes, they have taken root; they grow, yes, they bear fruit. You are near in their mouth, but far from their mind. But You, O Lord, know me; You have seen me, and tested my heart toward You. Pull them out like sheep for the slaughter, and prepare them for the day of slaughter. How long will the land mourn, and the herbs of every field wither? The beasts and the birds are consumed, because they said, "He will not see our final end."

hebrew_text: מָשָׁל לְאָדָם אֶחָד שֶׁאָמַר יָכוֹל אֲנִי לָרוּץ שָׁלֹשׁ פַּרְסָאוֹת לִפְנֵי הַסּוּסִים בֵּין בִּצְעֵי הַמַּיִם נִזְדַּמֵּן לוֹ רַגְלִי אֶחָד רָץ לְפָנָיו שְׁלֹשָׁה מִילִין בַּיַּבָּשָׁה וְנִלְאָה אָמְרוּ לוֹ וּמָה לִפְנֵי רַגְלִי כָּךְ לִפְנֵי הַסּוּסִים  עַל אַחַת כַּמָּה וְכַמָּה וּמָה שְׁלֹשֶׁת מִילִין כָּךְ שָׁלֹשׁ פַּרְסָאוֹת  עַל אַחַת כַּמָּה וְכַמָּה וּמָה בַּיַּבָּשָׁה כָּךְ בֵּין בִּצְעֵי הַמַּיִם  עַל אַחַת כַּמָּה וְכַמָּה
human_translation: a parable of a person who said: I can run three parasangs before the horses in the swamplands. He encountered a pedestrian ran before him three mil on dry land and wearied. said to him: And if before a pedestrian so before horses, all the more so And if three mil so three parasangs, all the more so And if on dry land so in the swamplands, all the more so
llm_translation: A parable to a man who said, "I can run three parasangs before the horses, between the water channels." A single foot appeared before him, he ran three mil in the dry land and became weary. They said to him, "If this is the case before your own foot, how much more so before the horses! How much more so three mil like this, three parasangs! How much more so in the dry land, like between the water channels! How much more so!"

hebrew_text: אַף אַתָּה וּמָה בִּשְׂכַר אַרְבַּע פְּסִיעוֹת שֶׁשִּׁלַּמְתִּי לְאוֹתוֹ רָשָׁע שֶׁרָץ אַחַר כְּבוֹדִי  אַתָּה תָּמֵיהַּ כְּשֶׁאֲנִי מְשַׁלֵּם שָׂכָר לְאַבְרָהָם יִצְחָק וְיַעֲקֹב שֶׁרָצוּ לְפָנַי כְּסוּסִים  עַל אַחַת כַּמָּה וְכַמָּה הַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב לַנְּבִאִים נִשְׁבַּר לִבִּי בְקִרְבִּי רָחֲפוּ כׇּל עַצְמֹתַי הָיִיתִי כְּאִישׁ שִׁכּוֹר וּכְגֶבֶר עֲבָרוֹ יָיִן מִפְּנֵי ה' וּמִפְּנֵי דִּבְרֵי קׇדְשׁוֹ
human_translation: So too, you, And if with regard to reward four paces that I compensated that wicked person, who ran in My honor, you are astonished when I compensate Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, who ran before Me like horses all the more so That is which is written: “Concerning the prophets. My heart within me is broken; all my bones shake; I am like a drunken man and like a man whom wine has overcome, due to the Lord and due to His sacred words”
llm_translation: You too, and what for the reward of four steps that I paid to that wicked one who pursued my honor? You are astonished when I pay reward to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob who ran before me like horses, how much more so! As it is written, "My heart is broken within me; all my bones tremble; I am like a drunken man, like a man overcome by wine, because of the Lord and because of His holy words."

hebrew_text: הָנֵי אַרְבַּע פְּסִיעוֹת מַאי הִיא דִּכְתִיב בָּעֵת הַהִיא שָׁלַח מְרֹדַךְ בַּלְאֲדָן בֶּן בַּלְאֲדָן מֶלֶךְ בָּבֶל סְפָרִים וְגוֹ' מִשּׁוּם כִּי חָלָה חִזְקִיָּהוּ וַיֶּחֱזָק שַׁדַּר לֵיהּ סְפָרִים וּמִנְחָה אִין לִדְרֹשׁ (אֶת) הַמּוֹפֵת אֲשֶׁר הָיָה בָאָרֶץ דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אוֹתוֹ הַיּוֹם שֶׁמֵּת בּוֹ אָחָז שְׁתֵּי שָׁעוֹת הָיָה
human_translation: these four paces what is as it is written: “At that time Merodach-Baladan, son of Baladan, king of Babylonia, sent a letter Due to Hezekiah had been ill and was recovered, he sent him a letter and a gift? Yes, “to inquire of the wonder that was in the land” As Rabbi Yoḥanan says: that day that Ahaz, died, two hours,
llm_translation: These four steps, what is it? As it is written, "At that time Merodach-baladan son of Baladan, king of Babylon, sent letters, etc." Because Hezekiah became ill and recovered, he sent him letters and a gift. There is no need to inquire about the miracle that was in the land, as Rabbi Yochanan said: On that day Ahaz died, he had two hours.

hebrew_text: וְכִי חָלָה חִזְקִיָּהוּ וְאִיתְּפַח אַהְדְּרִינְהוּ קוּדְשָׁא בְּרִיךְ הוּא לְהָנָךְ עֲשַׂר שָׁעֵי נִיהֲלֵיהּ דִּכְתִיב הִנְנִי מֵשִׁיב אֶת צֵל הַמַּעֲלוֹת אֲשֶׁר יָרְדָה בְמַעֲלוֹת אָחָז בַּשֶּׁמֶשׁ אֲחֹרַנִּית עֶשֶׂר מַעֲלוֹת וַתָּשׇׁב הַשֶּׁמֶשׁ עֶשֶׂר מַעֲלוֹת בַּמַּעֲלוֹת אֲשֶׁר יָרָדָה  אֲמַר לְהוּ מַאי הַאי אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ חִזְקִיָּהוּ חֲלַשׁ וְאִיתְּפַח אֲמַר אִיכָּא גַּבְרָא כִּי הַאי וְלָא בָּעֵינָא לְשַׁדּוֹרֵי לֵיהּ שְׁלָמָא כְּתַבוּ לֵיהּ שְׁלָמָא לְמַלְכָּא חִזְקִיָּה שְׁלָם לְקַרְתָּא דִּירוּשְׁלֶם שְׁלָם לֶאֱלָהָא רַבָּא
human_translation: And when Hezekiah fell ill and recovered, the Holy One, Blessed be He, restored those ten hours to as it is written: “Behold, I will return the shadow of the dial, which descended on the sundial of Ahaz, ten degrees backward. So the sun returned ten degrees, by which it had gone down” said to What is this They said to him: Hezekiah fell ill and recovered, said: There is a man like that and I do not need to send him greetings? wrote to Greetings to King Hezekiah, greetings to the city of Jerusalem, greetings to the great God.
llm_translation: And when Hezekiah became ill and was about to die, the Holy One, blessed be He, turned his face to the wall and prayed to Him, and Hezekiah wept bitterly. As it is written, "Behold, I will turn back the shadow of the degrees, which has gone down on the degrees of Ahaz with the sun, ten degrees backward." And the sun returned ten degrees by the degrees that it had gone down. He said to them, "What is this?" They said to him, "Hezekiah has become weak, and he wept." He said, "Is there a man like this, and I did not want to marry my daughter to him?" They wrote a marriage contract for him to the king Hezekiah, peace to the city of Jerusalem, peace to the great God.

hebrew_text: נְבוּכַדְנֶאצַּר סָפְרֵיהּ דְּבַלְאֲדָן הֲוָה הָהִיא שַׁעְתָּא לָא הֲוָה הָתָם כִּי אֲתָא אֲמַר לְהוּ הֵיכִי כָּתְבִיתוּ אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ הָכִי כָּתְבִינַן אֲמַר לְהוּ קְרֵיתוּ לֵיהּ אֱלָהָא רַבָּא וְכָתְבִיתוּ לֵיהּ לְבַסּוֹף אָמַר אֶלָּא הָכִי כְּתוּבוּ 'שְׁלָם לֶאֱלָהָא רַבָּא שְׁלָם לְקַרְתָּא דִּירוּשְׁלֶם שְׁלָם לְמַלְכָּא חִזְקִיָּה' אָמְרִי לֵיהּ קַרְיָינָא דְּאִיגַּרְתָּא אִיהוּ לֶיהֱוֵי פַּרְוַונְקָא
human_translation: Nebuchadnezzar was the scribe of Baladan, at that time he was not there. When he came he said to How did you write They said to him: We wrote this: said to You called him: The great God, and you wrote Him at the end He said: Rather, write this: Greetings to the great God, greetings to the city of Jerusalem, greetings to King Hezekiah. said to The one who reads the letter, let him be the messenger.
llm_translation: Nebuchadnezzar the scribe of Belshazzar was at that time not there when he came, he said to them, "How did you write it?" They said to him, "Thus we wrote." He said to them, "Read it to the great God and write it at the end." Instead, it is written thus: "Peace to the great God, peace to the city of Jerusalem, peace to King Hezekiah." They said to him, "The interpreter of dreams should interpret it for him."

hebrew_text: רְהַט בָּתְרֵיהּ כִּדְרָהֵיט אַרְבַּע פְּסִיעוֹת אֲתָא גַּבְרִיאֵל וְאוֹקְמֵיהּ אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אִילְמָלֵא לֹא בָּא גַּבְרִיאֵל וְהֶעֱמִידוֹ לֹא הָיָה תַּקָּנָה לְשׂוֹנְאֵיהֶם שֶׁל יִשְׂרָאֵל
human_translation: pursued When he ran four paces, Gabriel came and stopped his Rabbi Yoḥanan says: If Gabriel had not come and stopped his there would have been no remedy for the enemies of the Jewish people,
llm_translation: The man ran after him like a deer, four steps. Gabriel came and stood him up. Rabbi Yochanan said: If not for Gabriel coming and standing him up, there would have been a decree on the tongues of the Israelites.

hebrew_text: מַאי בַּלְאֲדָן בֶּן בַּלְאֲדָן אָמְרִי בַּלְאֲדָן מַלְכָּא הֲוָה וְאִישְׁתַּנִּי אַפֵּיהּ וַהֲוָה כִּי דְּכַלְבָּא הֲוָה יָתֵיב בְּרֵיהּ עַל מַלְכוּתָא כִּי הֲוָה כָּתֵיב הֲוָה כָּתֵיב שְׁמֵיהּ וּשְׁמֵיהּ דַּאֲבוּהּ בַּלְאֲדָן מַלְכָּא הַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב בֵּן יְכַבֵּד אָב וְעֶבֶד אֲדֹנָיו
human_translation: What is Baladan, son of Baladan? say: Baladan was a king, and his visage was transformed and became like that of a dog. His son was sitting on the throne and when he would write he would write his name and the name of his father, King Baladan. That is which is written “A son honors his father and a servant his master”
llm_translation: What is the meaning of "Baladan son of Baladan said Baladan the king was, and his face was turned away, for every dog would sit with his son on the throne, for it was written his name was written, and the name of his father was Baladan the king, that is as it is written, 'A son honors his father, and a servant his master.'"

hebrew_text: בֵּן יְכַבֵּד אָב הָא דַּאֲמַרַן וְעֶבֶד אֲדֹנָיו דִּכְתִיב וּבַחֹדֶשׁ הַחֲמִישִׁי בֶּעָשׂוֹר לַחֹדֶשׁ הִיא שְׁנַת תְּשַׁע עֶשְׂרֵה שָׁנָה לַמֶּלֶךְ נְבוּכַדְנֶאצַּר מֶלֶךְ בָּבֶל בָּא נְבוּזַרְאֲדָן רַב טַבָּחִים עָמַד לִפְנֵי מֶלֶךְ בָּבֶל בִּירוּשָׁלִָם וַיִּשְׂרֹף אֶת בֵּית ה' וְאֶת בֵּית הַמֶּלֶךְ
human_translation: “A son honors his father” that which we stated “And a servant his master” as it is written: “And in the fifth month, on the tenth day of the month, which was the nineteenth year of Nebuchadnezzar, king of Babylonia, came Nebuzaradan, captain of the guard, who stood before the king of Babylonia, into Jerusalem. And he burned the House of the Lord, and the house of the king”
llm_translation: Son honors father as we said, "And a servant his master," as it is written, "In the fifth month, on the tenth day of the month, which was the nineteenth year of King Nebuchadnezzar, king of Babylon, Nebuzaradan, the captain of the guard, who stood before the king of Babylon in Jerusalem, burned the house of the Lord and the king's house."

hebrew_text: וּמִי סְלֵיק נְבוּכַד־נֶצַּר לִירוּשָׁלַיִם וְהָכְתִיב וַיַּעֲלוּ אֹתוֹ אֶל מֶלֶךְ בָּבֶל רִבְלָתָה וְאָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ זוֹ אַנְטוֹכְיָא רַב חִסְדָּא וְרַב יִצְחָק בַּר אֲבוּדִימִי חַד אָמַר דְּמוּת דְּיוֹקְנוֹ הָיְתָה חֲקוּקָה לוֹ עַל מֶרְכַּבְתּוֹ וְחַד אָמַר אֵימָה יְתֵירָה הָיְתָה לוֹ מִמֶּנּוּ וְדוֹמֶה כְּמִי שֶׁעוֹמֵד לְפָנָיו
human_translation: And did Nebuchadnezzar ascend to Jerusalem? But isn’t it written and brought him up to the king of Babylonia, to Riblah” and Rabbi Abbahu says: This Antioch. Rav Ḥisda and Rav Yitzḥak bar Avudimi One says: An image of likeness was engraved on chariot, And one says: was in extreme fear of and it was as though was standing before
llm_translation: And who brought Nebuchadnezzar up to Jerusalem? And it is written, "And they brought him to the king of Babylon at Riblah." And Rabbi Abbahu said: This is Antiochus. Rav Hisda and Rav Yitzchak bar Avudimi, one said: A likeness of his image was engraved for him on his chariot, and one said: An extra fear was given to him from it, and it is likened to one who stands before him.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא טְעוֹן תְּלָת מְאָה כּוּדַנְיָיתָא נַרְגָּא דְפַרְזְלָא דְּשָׁלֵיט בְּפַרְזְלָא שַׁדַּר לֵיהּ נְבוּכַדְנֶצַּר לִנְבוּזַרְאֲדָן כּוּלְּהוּ בְּלַעְתִּינְהוּ חַד דַּשָּׁא דִּירוּשְׁלֶם שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר פִּתּוּחֶיהָ יָּחַד בְּכַשִּׁיל וְכֵילַפֹּת יַהֲלֹמוּן בָּעֵי לְמִיהְדַּר אָמַר מִסְתְּפֵינָא דְּלָא לִיעְבְּדוּ בִּי כִּי הֵיכִי דַּעֲבַדוּ בְּסַנְחֵרִיב
human_translation: Rava says: Nebuchadnezzar sent to Nebuzaradan three hundred mules laden with iron axes that cut iron. All of them were incapacitated one gate of Jerusalem, as it is stated: “And now they pound its carved work together with hatchet and with hammers” sought to return said: I am afraid. that they will not do to me just as they did to Sennacherib,
llm_translation: Rava said: Requires three hundred lamps of Kutinaita of iron, that is controlled by iron, he sent to Nebuchadnezzar to Nebuzaradan all of them in Jerusalem, as it is said, "Her gates have sunk into the ground; He has destroyed and broken her bars" (Lamentations 2:9). He said: I am afraid that they will not serve me, how shall I do with Sancheirev.

hebrew_text: נָפְקָא קָלָא וְאָמַר שָׁוַור בַּר שָׁוַור נְבוּזַרְאֲדָן שְׁוַור דִּמְטָא זִימְנָא דְּמַקְדְּשָׁא חֲרִיב וְהֵיכְלָא מִיקְּלֵי פָּשׁ לֵיהּ חַד נַרְגָּא אֲתָא מַחְיֵיהּ בְּקוֹפָא וְאִיפְּתַח שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר יִוָּדַע כְּמֵבִיא לְמָעְלָה בִּסְבׇךְ עֵץ קַרְדֻּמּוֹת
human_translation: Voice emerged and said: Leaper, son of a leaper; Nebuzaradan, take leap, as the time has arrived for the Temple to be destroyed and the Sanctuary to burn. One ax remained for him He went and struck with the dull end and it opened, as it is stated: “He became known as the wielder of axes upward in a thicket of trees”
llm_translation: A voice emerged and said, "Shavur bar Shavur, Nevuzaradan the ox, the ox that came at the appointed time of the Temple's destruction, and the chambers were opened for him. A certain demon came and struck him with a horn, and he died, as it is said, 'It shall be known as when one brings up to the top of the thicket wood of crimson.'"

hebrew_text: הֲוָה קָטֵיל וְאָזֵל עַד דִּמְטָא לְהֵיכְלָא אַדְלֵיק בֵּיהּ נוּרָא גְּבַהּ הֵיכְלָא דְּרַכוּ בֵּיהּ מִן שְׁמַיָּא שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר גַּת דָּרַךְ ה' לִבְתוּלַת בַּת יְהוּדָה קָא זִיחָא דַּעְתֵּיהּ נְפַקָא בַּת קָלָא וַאֲמַרָה לֵיהּ עַמָּא קְטִילָא קָטְלַתְּ הֵיכְלָא קַלְיָא קְלֵית קִימְחָא טְחִינָא טְחֵינְתְּ שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר 'קְחִי רֵחַיִם וְטַחֲנִי קָמַח גַּלִּי צַמָּתֵךְ חֶשְׂפִּי שֹׁבֶל גַּלִּי שׁוֹק עִבְרִי נְהָרוֹת' 'חִטִּים' לֹא נֶאֱמַר אֶלָּא 'קֶמַח'
human_translation: He was proceeding and killing until he reached the Sanctuary. he ignited a fire in it. The Sanctuary rose, They trod upon it from Heaven as it is stated: “The Lord has trodden the virgin, the daughter of Judah, as in a winepress” became haughty, A Divine Voice emerged and said to him: you killed a nation dead, you burned a Sanctuary burned, you ground flour ground, as it is stated “Take millstones and grind flour; uncover your locks, tuck up the train, uncover the leg, pass over rivers” It was not stated: wheat, but flour,”
llm_translation: He was killing and going until he reached the sanctuary, a light was shining in the height of the sanctuary, a path was made in it from the heavens, as it is said, "The virgin daughter of Judah has trodden a winepress" (Lamentations 1:15). His mind was unsettled, the daughter of a voice came out and said to him, "People of the city, you have killed, you have destroyed the sanctuary, you have consumed the flour, you have consumed the meal," as it is said, "Take millstones and grind flour, remove your veil, strip off the train, uncover the leg, pass through the rivers" (Isaiah 47:2). It does not say 'wheat' but 'flour.'

hebrew_text: חֲזָא דְּמֵיהּ דִּזְכַרְיָה דַּהֲוָה קָא רָתַח אָמַר לְהוּ מַאי הַאי אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ דַּם זְבָחִים הוּא דְּאִישְׁתְּפִיךְ אֲמַר לְהוּ אַיְיתֵי וַאֲנַסֵּי אִי מִדְּמוּ כַּסִּי וְלָא אִידְּמוֹ אֲמַר לְהוּ גַּלּוֹ לִי וְאִי לָא סָרֵיקְנָא לְכוּ לְבִשְׂרַיְיכוּ בְּמַסְרֵיקָא דְּפַרְזְלָא
human_translation: he saw the blood of Zechariah boiling. said to What is this? They said to him: It is the blood of offerings that was spilled. said to them: Bring and I will test if is similar He slaughtered and was not similar said to Reveal to me, and if not I will comb your flesh with an iron comb.
llm_translation: See the blood of the sacrifice that was boiling, he said to them, "What is this?" They said to him, "It is the blood of the sacrifices that is boiling." He said to them, "Bring it and let us test it, if it turns into earth, then it is blood, and if not, it is not blood." He said to them, "Reveal it to me, and if not, I will remove you to my flesh in the iron furnace."

hebrew_text: אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ הַאי כֹּהֵן וְנָבִיא הוּא דְּאִינַּבִּי לְהוּ לְיִשְׂרָאֵל בְּחוּרְבָּנָא דִּירוּשְׁלֶם וְקַטְלוּהּ אֲמַר לְהוּ אֲנָא מְפַיֵּיסְנָא לֵיהּ אַיְיתִי רַבָּנַן קָטֵיל עִילָּוֵיהּ וְלָא נָח אַיְיתִי דַּרְדַּקֵּי דְּבֵי רַב קָטֵיל עִילָּוֵיהּ וְלָא נָח אַיְיתִי פִּרְחֵי כְהוּנָּה קָטֵיל עִילָּוֵיהּ וְלָא נָח עַד דִּי קְטַל עִילָּוֵיהּ תִּשְׁעִין וְאַרְבְּעָה רִיבּוֹא וְלָא נָח
human_translation: said to This is a priest and a prophet who prophesied for the Jewish people with regard to the destruction of Jerusalem and whom they killed. He said to I will pacify He brought the Sages killed them over and did not cease. He brought schoolchildren killed them over and did not cease. He brought young priests killed them over and did not cease. until he killed 940,000 over and did not cease.
llm_translation: They said to him: This is a priest and a prophet who prophesied to Israel concerning the destruction of Jerusalem, and they killed him. He said to them: I will appease him. I brought Rabbanan to kill him, but it did not help. I brought the Dardekei of the house of Rav to kill him, but it did not help. I brought the Pirchei Kehunah to kill him, but it did not help until they killed him ninety-four thousand and did not help.

hebrew_text: קְרַב לְגַבֵּיהּ אֲמַר זְכַרְיָה זְכַרְיָה טוֹבִים שֶׁבָּהֶן אִיבַּדְתִּים נִיחָא לָךְ דְּאֶיקְטְלִינְהוּ לְכוּלְּהוּ מִיָּד נָח הַרְהַר תְּשׁוּבָה בְּדַעְתֵּיהּ אֲמַר מָה הֵם שֶׁלֹּא אִיבְּדוּ אֶלָּא נֶפֶשׁ אַחַת כָּךְ הָהוּא גַּבְרָא מָה תֶּיהְוֵי עֲלֵיהּ עֲרַק שַׁדַּר פּוּרְטֵיתָא לְבֵיתֵיהּ וְאִיתְגַּיַּיר
human_translation: approached said: Zechariah, Zechariah, the worthy among them I killed Is it satisfactory for you that I kill them all? Immediately ceased. contemplated repentance. He said: If they, who caused only one person to perish, this that man, what will be for him He deserted dispatched will to his house and converted.
llm_translation: Approaching his side, Zechariah said, "Zechariah, Zechariah, the good ones among them I have lost. It is pleasing to you that I have killed them all immediately." He pondered repentance in his mind and said, "What are they that they have not lost except one soul?" So that man, what will become of him? He sent a detailed message to his household and converted.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן נַעֲמָן גֵּר תּוֹשָׁב הָיָה נְבוּזַר־אֲדָן גֵּר צֶדֶק הָיָה מִבְּנֵי בָנָיו שֶׁל סִיסְרָא לִמְּדוּ תּוֹרָה בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם מִבְּנֵי בָנָיו שֶׁל סַנְחֵרִיב לִימְּדוּ תּוֹרָה בָּרַבִּים וּמַאן נִינְהוּ שְׁמַעְיָה וְאַבְטַלְיוֹן
human_translation: The Sages taught Naaman was a ger toshav , Nebuzaradan was righteous convert. Among the descendants of Sisera studied Torah in Jerusalem. Among the descendants of Sennacherib taught Torah in public. And who are they? Shemaya and Avtalyon.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: Naaman was a convert resident, Nebuzaradan was a righteous convert. They were descendants of Sisera. They studied Torah in Jerusalem. They were descendants of Sancheirev. They studied Torah in public. And who were they? Shemaiah and Avtalyon.

hebrew_text: מִבְּנֵי בָּנָיו שֶׁל הָמָן לִמְּדוּ תּוֹרָה בִּבְנֵי בְּרָק וְאַף מִבְּנֵי בָּנָיו שֶׁל אוֹתוֹ רָשָׁע בִּיקֵּשׁ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לְהִכְנִיסָן תַּחַת כַּנְפֵי הַשְּׁכִינָה אָמְרוּ מַלְאֲכֵי הַשָּׁרֵת לִפְנֵי הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא 'רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם מִי שֶׁהֶחֱרִיב אֶת בֵּיתְךָ וְשָׂרַף אֶת הֵיכָלֶךָ תַּכְנִיס תַּחַת כַּנְפֵי הַשְּׁכִינָה' הַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב רִפִּינוּ אֶת בָּבֶל וְלֹא נִרְפָּתָה עוּלָּא אָמַר זֶה נְבוּכַדְנֶצַּר רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר אֵלּוּ נַהֲרוֹת בָּבֶל וְתַרְגֻּמַהּ (דְּ)צִינְיָיתָא צְרִידָתָא דְּבַבְלָאֵי
human_translation: Among the descendants of Haman studied Torah in Bnei Brak. And even among the descendants of that wicked the Holy One, Blessed be He, sought to bring beneath the wings of the Divine Presence The ministering angels said before the Holy One, Blessed be He: Master of the Universe: one who destroyed Your House and burned Your Sanctuary, You introduce beneath the wings of the Divine Presence? That is which is written: “We have healed Babylonia, but she is not healed” Ulla says: This is Nebuchadnezzar, Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani says: these are the rivers of Babylonia, and interpret it the bitter saltwater rivers of Babylonia.
llm_translation: From the sons of the descendants of Haman they learned Torah in the sons of Barak, and even from the sons of his descendants, that wicked one sought to bring them under the wings of the Divine Presence. The ministering angels said before the Holy One, blessed be He, "Master of the Universe, one who destroyed Your Temple and burned Your Sanctuary, will You bring them under the wings of the Divine Presence?" This is as it is written, "Rip Babylon apart and do not spare its young men" - this refers to Nebuchadnezzar. Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said, "These are the rivers of Babylon and its interpreter, the Tigris, the wall of the Babylonians."

hebrew_text: אָמַר עוּלָּא עַמּוֹן וּמוֹאָב שִׁיבָבֵי בִּישֵׁי דִּירוּשְׁלֶם הֲווֹ כֵּיוָן דְּשַׁמְעִינְהוּ לִנְבִיאֵי דְּקָא מִיתְנַבְּאִי לְחוּרְבָּנָא דִּירוּשְׁלֶם שְׁלַחוּ לִנְבוּכַדְנֶצַּר פּוֹק וְתָא אָמַר מִסְתְּפֵינָא דְּלָא לִיעְבְּדוּ לִי כְּדַעֲבַדוּ בְּקַמָּאֵי
human_translation: Ulla says: Ammon and Moab were bad neighbors of Jerusalem. Once they heard the prophets who prophesied about the destruction of the Jerusalem, they sent to Nebuchadnezzar: Emerge and come said I am afraid. that they will not do to me just as they did to predecessors.
llm_translation: Ula said: Ammon and Moab, the captives of Jerusalem, were like the two sons of Bilaam, for when they heard the prophets prophesying about the destruction of Jerusalem, they sent to Nebuchadnezzar saying, "Go and come." He said, "I am troubled that they should not serve me as they served in the days of my ancestors."

hebrew_text: שְׁלַחוּ לֵיהּ 'כִּי אֵין הָאִישׁ בְּבֵיתוֹ הָלַךְ בְּדֶרֶךְ מֵרָחוֹק' וְאֵין אִישׁ אֶלָּא הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר 'ה' אִישׁ מִלְחָמָה' שְׁלַח לְהוּ בְּקָרִיבָא הוּא וְאָתֵי שְׁלַחוּ לֵיהּ הָלַךְ בְּדֶרֶךְ מֵרָחוֹק שְׁלַח לְהוּ אִית לְהוּ צַדִּיקֵי דְּבָעוּ רַחֲמֵי וּמַיְיתוּ לֵיהּ
human_translation: sent to him “For the ish is not at home; he is gone on a long journey” and ish no but the Holy One, Blessed be He, as it is stated: “The Lord is an ish of war” sent to them He is in a nearby and He will come. sent to “He has gone on a journey from afar” said to them: They have righteous who will pray for mercy and bring Him
llm_translation: Send to him 'for the man is not in his house, he went on a journey from afar' and 'man' is none other than the Holy One, blessed be He, as it is stated 'Hashem is a man of war' send to him nearby he is, and when they sent to him, he went on a journey from afar, they sent to him righteous ones who beseech for mercy and they brought him.

hebrew_text: שְׁלַחוּ לֵיהּ 'צְרוֹר הַכֶּסֶף לָקַח בְּיָדוֹ' וְאֵין כֶּסֶף אֶלָּא צַדִּיקִים שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר 'וָאֶכְּרֶהָ לִּי בַּחֲמִשָּׁה עָשָׂר כָּסֶף וְחֹמֶר שְׂעֹרִים וְלֵתֶךְ שְׂעֹרִים'
human_translation: sent to “He has taken a bundle of kesef with him” and kesef nothing other than the righteous, as it is stated: “So I bought her to me for fifteen pieces of kesef and for a kor of barley and a half- kor of barley”
llm_translation: Send to him 'a bundle of silver he took in his hand' and there is no money except for the righteous, as it is said 'and I weighed out for her fifteen pieces of silver and barley and a measure of barley.'

hebrew_text: שְׁלַח לְהוּ הָדְרִי רַשִּׁיעֵי בִּתְשׁוּבָה וּבָעוּ רַחֲמֵי וּמַיְיתוּ לֵיהּ שְׁלַחוּ לֵיהּ כְּבָר קָבַע לָהֶן זְמַן שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר 'לְיוֹם הַכֶּסֶא יָבֹא בֵּיתוֹ' אֵין כֶּסֶא אֶלָּא זְמַן שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר 'בַּכֵּסֶה לְיוֹם חַגֵּנוּ' שְׁלַח לְהוּ סִיתְווֹא הוּא וְלָא מָצֵינָא דְּאָתֵי מִתַּלְגָא וּמִמִּיטְרָא
human_translation: sent to them: the wicked will repent and they will pray for mercy and they will bring Him sent to God already designated the time of their as it is stated: “On the day of the keseh , He will come home” keseh nothing other than time, as it is stated: at the keseh on the day of our feast” sent to them: It is winter and I cannot come due to the snow and the rain.
llm_translation: Send to him the Hadri Rashie'i in repentance, and they sought mercy, and they brought him. Send to him as he has established for them a time, as it is stated, "On the day of the appointed time he would come to his house." A throne is nothing but a time, as it is stated, "In the covering for the day of our festival." Send to him a bribe, but we did not find that it comes from the dew and the rain.

hebrew_text: שְׁלַחוּ לֵיהּ תָּא אַשִּׁינָּא דְּטוּרָא שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר 'שִׁלְחוּ כַר מוֹשֵׁל אֶרֶץ מִסֶּלַע מִדְבָּרָה אֶל הַר בַּת צִיּוֹן' שְׁלַח לְהוּ אִי אָתֵינָא לֵית לִי דּוּכְתָּא דְּיָתֵיבְנָא בֵּיהּ שְׁלַחוּ לֵיהּ קְבָרוֹת שֶׁלָּהֶם מְעוּלִּין מִפַּלְטֵירִין שֶׁלְּךָ דִּכְתִיב 'בָּעֵת הַהִיא נְאֻם ה' יוֹצִיאוּ אֶת עַצְמוֹת מַלְכֵי יְהוּדָה וְאֶת עַצְמוֹת שָׂרָיו וְאֶת עַצְמוֹת הַכֹּהֲנִים וְאֵת עַצְמוֹת הַנְּבִיאִים וְאֵת עַצְמוֹת יוֹשְׁבֵי יְרוּשָׁלִָים מִקִּבְרֵיהֶם וּשְׁטָחוּם לַשֶּׁמֶשׁ וְלַיָּרֵחַ וּלְכֹל צְבָא הַשָּׁמַיִם אֲשֶׁר אֲהֵבוּם וַאֲשֶׁר עֲבָדוּם וַאֲשֶׁר הָלְכוּ אַחֲרֵיהֶם'
