human_translation: sent to him: Come on the peaks of mountains, as it is stated: “Send the lamb to the ruler of the land from the peaks of the wilderness to the mount of the daughter of Zion” sent to them: If I come I have no place to dwell sent to him: Their burial caves are superior to your palaces, as it is written: “At that time, says the Lord, they shall remove the bones of the kings of Judea, and the bones of his princes, and the bones of the priests, and the bones of the prophets and the bones of the inhabitants of Jerusalem from their graves; and they shall spread them before the sun and the moon and all of the hosts of heaven, whom they have loved, and whom they have served, and after whom they have walked”
llm_translation: Send to him a box of incense, as it is stated, "Send the ruler of the land from Sela in the desert to the mountain of the daughter of Zion." Send to him, if I come, I have no incense that I can sit with him. Send to him their graves that are superior to your palaces, as it is written, "At that time, says the Lord, they shall bring out the bones of the kings of Judah, and the bones of its princes, and the bones of the priests, and the bones of the prophets, and the bones of the inhabitants of Jerusalem from their graves. And they shall spread them out to the sun, and to the moon, and to all the host of heaven, which they loved, and which they served, and after which they walked."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב נַחְמָן לְרַבִּי יִצְחָק מִי שְׁמִיעַ לָךְ אֵימַת אָתֵי 'בַּר נַפְלֵי' אֲמַר לֵיהּ מַאן 'בַּר נַפְלֵי' אֲמַר לֵיהּ מָשִׁיחַ מָשִׁיחַ 'בַּר נַפְלֵי' קָרֵית לֵיהּ אֲמַר לֵיהּ אִין דִּכְתִיב 'בַּיּוֹם הַהוּא אָקִים
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said to Rabbi Yitzḥak: Have you heard when the son of giants [ bar niflei ] will come? said to him: Who the son of giants? said to him: Messiah. you call the Messiah son of giants? said to him: Yes, as it is written: “On that day I will establish
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Nachman said to Rabbi Yitzchak, "Who has informed you of the time when 'Bar Naflei' will come?" He said to him, "Who is 'Bar Naflei'?" He said to him, "Messiah." Messiah 'Bar Naflei' you have called him. He said to him, "Is it not written, 'On that day I will raise up'?"

hebrew_text: אֶת סֻכַּת דָּוִיד הַנֹּפֶלֶת' אֲמַר לֵיהּ הָכִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן דּוֹר שֶׁבֶּן דָּוִד בָּא בּוֹ תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים מִתְמַעֲטִים וְהַשְּׁאָר עֵינֵיהֶם כָּלוֹת בְּיָגוֹן וַאֲנָחָה וְצָרוֹת רַבּוֹת וּגְזֵרוֹת קָשׁוֹת מִתְחַדְּשׁוֹת עַד שֶׁהָרִאשׁוֹנָה פְּקוּדָה שְׁנִיָּה מְמַהֶרֶת לָבֹא
human_translation: the Tabernacle of David that is fallen [ hanofelet ]” said to him this Rabbi Yoḥanan says: the generation in which son of David, comes, Torah scholars decrease; and the rest their eyes fail with sorrow and grief, and troubles increase. And the harsh decrees will be introduced; before the first passes the second quickly comes.
llm_translation: The sukkah of David that falls, he said to him thus said Rabbi Yochanan: A generation in which the son of David comes, the disciples of the sages diminish, and the rest of the people, their eyes are consumed with sorrow and sighing, and great troubles and harsh decrees are renewed until the first one is completed, the second one hastens to come.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן שָׁבוּעַ שֶׁבֶּן דָּוִד בָּא בּוֹ שָׁנָה רִאשׁוֹנָה מִתְקַיֵּים מִקְרָא זֶה 'וְהִמְטַרְתִּי עַל עִיר אֶחָת וְעַל עִיר אַחַת לֹא אַמְטִיר' שְׁנִיָּה  חִיצֵּי רָעָב מִשְׁתַּלְּחִים שְׁלִישִׁית  רָעָב גָּדוֹל וּמֵתִים אֲנָשִׁים וְנָשִׁים וָטַף חֲסִידִים וְאַנְשֵׁי מַעֲשֶׂה וְתוֹרָה מִשְׁתַּכַּחַת מִלּוֹמְדֶיהָ בִּרְבִיעִית  שׂוֹבַע וְאֵינוֹ שׂוֹבַע בַּחֲמִישִׁית  שׂוֹבַע גָּדוֹל וְאוֹכְלִין וְשׁוֹתִין וּשְׂמֵחִין וְתוֹרָה חוֹזֶרֶת לְלוֹמְדֶיהָ בְּשִׁשִּׁית  קוֹלוֹת בִּשְׁבִיעִית  מִלְחָמוֹת בְּמוֹצָאֵי שְׁבִיעִית  בֶּן דָּוִד בָּא
human_translation: The Sages taught the seven-year during which son of David, comes: the first year, this verse will be fulfilled: “And I will cause it to rain upon one city and cause it not to rain upon another city” second arrows of famine will be shot, third there will be a great famine, and men, women, children, the pious, and men of action will die, and the Torah is forgotten by those who study it. During the fourth plenty but not plenty. During the fifth great plenty and they will eat, and drink, and rejoice, and the Torah will return to those who study it. During the sixth voices During the Sabbatical wars, During the conclusion of the Sabbatical the son of David will come.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: A seven-year cycle in which the son of David will come, in the first year, this verse is fulfilled: "And I will make it rain upon one city, and upon another city I will not make it rain." In the second year, arrows of famine are sent. In the third year, a great famine, and men, women, and children die, pious individuals and men of action, and the Torah is forgotten by its students. In the fourth year, plenty is restored, but not in full. In the fifth year, there is great abundance, and people eat, drink, and rejoice, and the Torah returns to its students. In the sixth year, voices are heard. In the seventh year, wars, and at the conclusion of the seventh year, the son of David will come.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף הָא כַּמָּה (שְׁבִיעִיֹּת) [שָׁבוּעֵי] דַּהֲוָה כֵּן וְלָא אֲתָא אָמַר אַבָּיֵי בְּשִׁשִּׁית קוֹלוֹת בִּשְׁבִיעִית מִלְחָמוֹת מִי הֲוָה וְעוֹד כְּסִדְרָן מִי הֲוָה
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: Haven’t there been several Sabbatical which transpired that and did not come? Abaye said: Have During the sixth voices, during the Sabbatical wars, transpired? And furthermore, have transpired in order
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: How many seventh weeks were there that were so, and did not come? Abaye said: In the sixth week His voice was heard, in the seventh week His wars were fought. Who was He, and who was His order?

hebrew_text: אֲשֶׁר חֵרְפוּ אוֹיְבֶיךָ ה' אֲשֶׁר חֵרְפוּ עִקְּבוֹת מְשִׁיחֶךָ תַּנְיָא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר דּוֹר שֶׁבֶּן דָּוִד בָּא בּוֹ בֵּית הַוַּועַד יִהְיֶה לִזְנוּת וְהַגָּלִיל יֶחֱרַב וְהַגַּבְלָן יֵאשַׁם וְאַנְשֵׁי גְבוּל יְסוֹבְבוּ מֵעִיר לָעִיר וְלֹא יְחוֹנָנוּ וְחׇכְמַת הַסּוֹפְרִים תִּסְרַח וְיִרְאֵי חֵטְא יִמָּאֵסוּ וּפְנֵי הַדּוֹר כִּפְנֵי כֶלֶב
human_translation: “That Your enemies taunted, Lord, that they have taunted the footsteps of Your anointed” It is taught Rabbi Yehuda says: During the generation that the son of David comes, the hall of the assembly will be for prostitution, and the Galilee will be destroyed, and the Gavlan, will be desolate, and the residents of the border will circulate from city to city and will receive no sympathy. The wisdom of scholars will diminish, and sin-fearing will be despised. And the face of the generation will be like the face of a dog
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Which they have reproached, O Lord, which they have reproached the footsteps of Your anointed one." It was taught: Rabbi Yehuda says, "In the generation when the son of David comes, the meeting place of scholars will be for licentiousness, Galilee will be destroyed, Gablan will be desolate, and the people of the border will wander from city to city and will not be shown mercy. The wisdom of the scribes will become putrid, and those who fear sin will be despised, and the face of the generation will be like the face of a dog."

hebrew_text: וְהָאֱמֶת נֶעְדֶּרֶת שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר 'וַתְּהִי הָאֱמֶת נֶעְדֶּרֶת וְסָר מֵרָע מִשְׁתּוֹלֵל' מַאי וַתְּהִי הָאֱמֶת נֶעְדֶּרֶת אָמְרִי דְּבֵי רַב מְלַמֵּד שֶׁנַּעֲשֵׂית עֲדָרִים עֲדָרִים וְהוֹלֶכֶת לָהּ מַאי וְסָר מֵרָע מִשְׁתּוֹלֵל אָמְרִי דְּבֵי רַבִּי שֵׁילָא כׇּל מִי שֶׁסָּר מֵרָע  מִשְׁתּוֹלֵל עַל הַבְּרִיּוֹת
human_translation: And the truth will be lacking, as it is stated: “And the truth is lacking [ ne’ederet ], and he who departs from evil is negated” What And the truth is lacking [ ne’ederet ]? the study hall of Rav said: teaches that will become like flocks [ adarim ] and walk What “And he that departs from evil is negated”? the study hall of Rabbi Sheila said: Anyone who deviates from evil is deemed insane by the people.
llm_translation: The truth is missing, as it is stated: "And truth is missing, and one who turns away from evil is plundered." What is meant by "And truth is missing"? The House of Rav said: that it becomes missing in flocks, flock by flock, and it goes away from it. What is meant by "and one who turns away from evil is plundered"? The House of Rabbi Sheila said: anyone who turns away from evil is plundered among the creatures.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא מֵרֵישׁ הֲוָה אָמֵינָא לֵיכָּא קוּשְׁטָא בְּעָלְמָא אֲמַר לִי הָהוּא מֵרַבָּנַן וְרַב טָבוּת שְׁמֵיהּ וְאָמְרִי לַהּ רַב טָבְיוֹמֵי שְׁמֵיהּ דְּאִי הֲווֹ יָהֲבִי לֵיהּ כֹּל חֲלָלֵי דְּעָלְמָא לָא הֲוָה מְשַׁנֵּי בְּדִיבּוּרֵיהּ זִימְנָא חֲדָא אִיקְּלַעִי לְהָהוּא אַתְרָא וְקוּשְׁטָא שְׁמֵיהּ וְלָא הֲווֹ מְשַׁנֵּי בְּדִיבּוּרַיְיהוּ וְלָא הֲוָה מָיֵית אִינִישׁ מֵהָתָם בְּלָא זִימְנֵיהּ נְסֵיבִי אִיתְּתָא מִינְּהוֹן וַהֲווֹ לִי (תַּרְתֵּין) [תְּרֵין] בְּנִין מִינַּהּ
human_translation: Rava says: Initially I would say there is no truth in the world. a certain one of the Sages, and Rav Tavut is his name, and some say Rav Tavyomei is his name, that if they were give him the entire world, he would not deviate in his statement. One time I happened to a certain place, and Truth is its name, and would not deviate in their statements, and no person from there would die prematurely. I married a woman from them, and I had two sons from her.
llm_translation: Rava said: Initially, I thought there was no integrity in the world. That one, a Sage, told me, and Rav Tavut is his name, and some say to him, "Rav Tavyumei" is his name, for if they were to give him all the vessels of the world, he would not change his speech. One time, he entered that place, and his name was Kushta, and he did not change his speech. And no person ever left there without marrying one of his daughters, and I have two sons from him.

hebrew_text: יוֹמָא חַד הֲוָה יָתְבָא דְּבֵיתְהוּ וְקָא חָיְיפָא רֵישָׁא אֲתַאי שִׁיבָבְתַהּ טְרַפָא אַדַּשָּׁא סְבַרִ[י] לָאו אוֹרַח אַרְעָא אֲמַרִי לַהּ לֵיתַהּ הָכָא שְׁכִיבוּ לֵיהּ (תַּרְתֵּין בְּנִין) [תְּרֵין בְּנֵיהּ] אֲתוֹ אִינָשֵׁי דְּאַתְרָא לְקַמֵּיהּ אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ מַאי הַאי אֲמַר לְהוּ הָכִי הֲוָה מַעֲשֶׂה אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ בְּמָטוּתָא מִינָּךְ פּוֹק מֵאַתְרִין וְלָא תְּגָרֵי בְּהוּ מוֹתָנָא בְּהָנָךְ אִינָשֵׁי
human_translation: One day his wife was sitting and washing the head. Her neighbor came knocked on the door. He thought: not proper conduct He said to her: She is not here. his two sons died. The people in place came before him said to him: What this? He said to them: This was incident, They said to him: Please leave our place and do not provoke death upon these people.
llm_translation: One day he was sitting in his house, and he covered his head. His grandmother's daughter came and brought him a dish of lentils. He thought it was not the way of the land. They said to him, "Here, lie down." Thirty-two people came and saw him. They said to him, "What is this?" He said to them, "This is what happened." They said to him, "Your blood be on your own head; go out and do not engage in discussions with people."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא רַבִּי נְהוֹרַאי אוֹמֵר דּוֹר שֶׁבֶּן דָּוִד בָּא בּוֹ נְעָרִים יַלְבִּינוּ פְּנֵי זְקֵנִים וּזְקֵנִים יַעַמְדוּ לִפְנֵי נְעָרִים וּבַת קָמָה בְּאִמָּהּ וְכַלָּה בַּחֲמוֹתָהּ וּפְנֵי הַדּוֹר כִּפְנֵי כֶלֶב וְאֵין הַבֵּן מִתְבַּיֵּישׁ מֵאָבִיו
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Nehorai says: During the generation which the son of David comes, youths will humiliate elders and elders will stand before youths, and a daughter will rebel against her mother, and a bride against her mother-in-law, and the face of the generation will be like the face of a dog, and a son will not be ashamed before his father.
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Nehorai says, the generation of the son of David will come, young people will shame the faces of elders, and elders will stand before young people. A daughter rises against her mother, a bride against her mother-in-law, and the face of the generation is like the face of a dog, and a son does not feel ashamed before his father.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא רַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה אוֹמֵר דּוֹר שֶׁבֶּן דָּוִד בָּא בּוֹ הָעַזּוּת תִּרְבֶּה וְהַיּוֹקָר יְעַוֵּת וְהַגֶּפֶן יִתֵּן פִּרְיוֹ וְהַיַּיִן בְּיוֹקֶר וְנֶהֱפָכָה כׇּל הַמַּלְכוּת לְמִינוּת וְאֵין תּוֹכֵחָה מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי יִצְחָק דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק אֵין בֶּן דָּוִד בָּא עַד שֶׁתִּתְהַפֵּךְ כׇּל הַמַּלְכוּת לְמִינוּת אָמַר רָבָא מַאי קְרָא  כֻּלּוֹ הָפַךְ לָבָן טָהוֹר הוּא
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Neḥemya says: During the generation that the son of David comes, arrogance will proliferate and the cost will corrupt The vine will produce its fruit, and the wine costly. And the entire monarchy will be converted to heresy and there will be no rebuke. supports Rabbi Yitzḥak, as Rabbi Yitzḥak says: The son of David will not come until the entire kingdom will be converted to heresy. Rava says: What is the verse “It is all turned white; he is ritually pure”
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Nechemiah says, "The generation in which the son of David will come, impudence will increase, honor will be perverted, the vine will yield its fruit abundantly, but wine will be costly, and the kingdom will be converted to heresy. And reproof will be of no avail." To Rabbi Yitzchak, for Rabbi Yitzchak said, "The son of David will not come until the kingdom is converted to heresy." Rava said, "What is the verse? 'He has wholly turned to pure white.'"

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן 'כִּי יָדִין ה' עַמּוֹ [וְגוֹ'] כִּי יִרְאֶה כִּי אָזְלַת יָד וְאֶפֶס עָצוּר וְעָזוּב' אֵין בֶּן דָּוִד בָּא עַד שֶׁיִּרְבּוּ הַמָּסוֹרוֹת דָּבָר אַחֵר עַד שֶׁיִּתְמַעֲטוּ הַתַּלְמִידִים דָּבָר אַחֵר עַד שֶׁתִּכְלֶה פְּרוּטָה מִן הַכִּיס דָּבָר אַחֵר עַד שֶׁיִּתְיָיאֲשׁוּ מִן הַגְּאוּלָּה שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר 'וְאֶפֶס עָצוּר וְעָזוּב' כִּבְיָכוֹל אֵין סוֹמֵךְ וְעוֹזֵר לְיִשְׂרָאֵל
human_translation: The Sages taught “For the Lord shall judge His people when He sees that their power is gone and there is none shut up or left” the son of David will not come until informers will proliferate. Alternatively, until the students diminishes. Alternatively, until peruta will cease from the purse. Alternatively, until they despair from the redemption, as it is stated: “And there is none shut up or left,” as though there were no supporter or helper for the Jewish people.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: "When the Lord judges His people, 'when He sees that their power is gone, and there is none left, shut up or left' (Deuteronomy 32:36), the son of David will not come until the traditions are multiplied; another matter, until the disciples decrease; another matter, until the small coin is exhausted from the purse; another matter, until they despair of redemption, as it is stated: 'and there is none left, shut up or left' - when they are exhausted, relying and helping Israel."

hebrew_text: כִּי הָא דְּרַבִּי זֵירָא כִּי הֲוָה מַשְׁכַּח רַבָּנַן דְּמִעַסְּקִי בֵּיהּ אֲמַר לְהוּ בְּמָטוּתָא בָּעֵינָא מִנַּיְיכוּ לָא תְּרַחֲקוּהּ דִּתְנֵינָא 'שְׁלֹשָׁה בָּאִין בְּהֶיסַּח הַדַּעַת אֵלּוּ הֵן מָשִׁיחַ מְצִיאָה וְעַקְרָב'
human_translation: as that of Rabbi Zeira, when he would find Sages who were engaging in said to them: Please, I ask of you, do not delay As we learn three come by means of diversion of attention and these are they: Messiah, a lost item, and a scorpion.
llm_translation: This is what Rabbi Zeira, when he would find scholars engaging in it, said to them: "I require an explanation from you. For we learned: 'Three come in a state of mental confusion - these are the Messiah, a found object, and a scorpion.'"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב קַטִּינָא שֵׁית אַלְפֵי שְׁנֵי (הָווּ) [הָוֵי] עָלְמָא וְחַד חָרוּב שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וְנִשְׂגַּב ה' לְבַדּוֹ בַּיּוֹם הַהוּא אַבָּיֵי אָמַר תְּרֵי חָרוּב שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר יְחַיֵּינוּ מִיֹּמָיִם בַּיּוֹם הַשְּׁלִישִׁי יְקִמֵנוּ וְנִחְיֶה לְפָנָיו
human_translation: Rav Ketina says: Six thousand years is the world, it is in ruins one as it is stated: “And the Lord alone shall be exalted on that day” Abaye says: It is in ruins two as it is stated: “After two days He will revive us; in the third day He will revive us, and we shall live in His presence”
llm_translation: Rav Katina said: Six thousand years the world will exist, and one thousand it will be desolate, as it is stated, "And the Lord alone shall be exalted on that day" (Isaiah 2:11). Abbaye said: Two thousand years desolate, as it is stated, "He will revive us after two days; on the third day, He will raise us up, and we shall live in His presence" (Hosea 6:2).

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּוָתֵיהּ דְּרַב קַטִּינָא כְּשֵׁם שֶׁהַשְּׁבִיעִית מְשַׁמֶּטֶת שָׁנָה אַחַת לְשֶׁבַע שָׁנִים כָּךְ הָעוֹלָם מְשַׁמֵּט אֶלֶף שָׁנִים לְשִׁבְעַת אֲלָפִים שָׁנָה שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר 'וְנִשְׂגַּב ה' לְבַדּוֹ בַּיּוֹם הַהוּא' וְאוֹמֵר 'מִזְמוֹר שִׁיר לְיוֹם הַשַּׁבָּת' יוֹם שֶׁכּוּלּוֹ שַׁבָּת וְאוֹמֵר 'כִּי אֶלֶף שָׁנִים בְּעֵינֶיךָ כְּיוֹם אֶתְמוֹל כִּי יַעֲבֹר'
human_translation: It is taught in accordance with of Rav Ketina: Just as the Sabbatical abrogates once in seven years, so too, the world abrogates one thousand years in seven thousand years, as it is stated: “And the Lord alone shall be exalted on that day,” and it states: “A psalm, a song for the Shabbat day” a day, that is entirely Shabbat. And it says “For a thousand years in Your eyes are but like yesterday when it is past,
llm_translation: It was taught in the school of Rav Katina: Just as the seventh year releases one year in seven years, so too the world releases one thousand years in seven thousand years, as it is stated, "And the Lord alone shall be exalted on that day" (Isaiah 2:17), and it says, "A Psalm, a Song for the Sabbath day" (Psalm 92:1), a day that is entirely Sabbath. And it says, "For a thousand years in Your sight are but as yesterday when it is past" (Psalm 90:4).

hebrew_text: תָּנָא דְּבֵי אֵלִיָּהוּ שֵׁשֶׁת אֲלָפִים שָׁנָה הָוֵי עָלְמָא שְׁנֵי אֲלָפִים תּוֹהוּ שְׁנֵי אֲלָפִים תּוֹרָה שְׁנֵי אֲלָפִים יְמוֹת הַמָּשִׁיחַ
human_translation: The school of Eliyahu taught: Six thousand years is the world. Two thousand chaos; two thousand Torah, two thousand years the period of the Messiah.
llm_translation: It was taught in the school of Elijah: Six thousand years is the world, two thousand years of chaos, two thousand years of Torah, and two thousand years of the days of the Messiah.

hebrew_text: וּבַעֲוֹנוֹתֵינוּ שֶׁרַבּוּ יָצְאוּ מֵהֶם מָה שֶׁיֵּצְאוּ
human_translation: but due to our many sins, that elapsed since have elapsed.
llm_translation: And in our sins that have multiplied, from them have come out what they have come out.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אֵלִיָּהוּ לְרַב יְהוּדָה אֲחוּהּ דְּרַב סַלָּא חֲסִידָא אֵין הָעוֹלָם פָּחוֹת מִשְּׁמוֹנִים וַחֲמִשָּׁה יוֹבְלוֹת וּבַיּוֹבֵל הָאַחֲרוֹן בֶּן דָּוִד בָּא אֲמַר לֵיהּ בִּתְחִילָּתוֹ אוֹ בְּסוֹפוֹ אֲמַר לֵיהּ אֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ כָּלֶה אוֹ אֵינוֹ כָּלֶה אֲמַר לֵיהּ אֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר הָכִי אֲמַר לֵיהּ עַד הָכָא לָא תִּיסְתַּכֵּי לֵיהּ מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ אִיסְתַּכֵּי לֵיהּ
human_translation: Elijah said to Rav Yehuda, brother of Rav Sala Ḥasida: The world will no fewer than eighty-five Jubilee And during the final Jubilee, the son of David come. said to during the beginning of or during its end? said to I do not know. end or not end said to him: I do not know. Rav Ashi says: This Elijah said to him: Until that time do not anticipate his from this forward anticipate his
llm_translation: He said to him, Elijah to Rav Yehudah the brother of Rav Salla the pious, "The world is not less than eighty-five Jubilees, and in the last Jubilee, the son of David will come." He said to him, "At its beginning or at its end?" He said to him, "I do not know." Rav Ashi said thus, he said to him, "Until here you may ask him, from here on you may not ask him."

hebrew_text: שְׁלַח לֵיהּ רַב חָנָן בַּר תַּחְלִיפָא לְרַב יוֹסֵף מָצָאתִי אָדָם אֶחָד וּבְיָדוֹ מְגִילָּה אַחַת כְּתוּבָה אַשּׁוּרִית וּלְשׁוֹן קֹדֶשׁ אָמַרְתִּי לוֹ 'זוֹ מִנַּיִין לָךְ' אָמַר לִי 'לַחֲיָילוֹת שֶׁל רוֹמִי נִשְׂכַּרְתִּי וּבֵין גִּינְזֵי רוֹמִי מְצָאתִיהָ' וְכָתוּב בָּהּ 'לְאַחַר אַרְבַּעַת אֲלָפִים וּמָאתַיִם וְתִשְׁעִים וְאֶחָד שָׁנָה לִבְרִיאָתוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם  הָעוֹלָם יִתּוֹם' מֵהֶן מִלְחֲמוֹת תַּנִּינִים מֵהֶן מִלְחָמוֹת גּוֹג וּמָגוֹג וּשְׁאָר יְמוֹת הַמָּשִׁיחַ וְאֵין הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא מְחַדֵּשׁ אֶת עוֹלָמוֹ אֶלָּא לְאַחַר שִׁבְעַת אֲלָפִים שָׁנָה רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרָבָא אָמַר לְאַחַר חֲמֵשֶׁת אֲלָפִים שָׁנָה אִיתְּמַר
human_translation: Rav Ḥanan bar Taḥlifa sent to Rav Yosef: I found one man, and in his hand one scroll written Ashurit and the sacred tongue, I said to him: From where this into your He said to me: I was hired to the Roman army and I found among the Roman archives. And it is written in After 4,291 years from the creation of the world, the world will end; during the wars of the sea monsters among the wars of Gog and Magog and the remaining messianic period. And the Holy One, Blessed be He, will renew His world only after seven thousand years. Rav Aḥa, son of Rava, says it was stated: After five thousand years.
llm_translation: Send to him Rav Hanan son of Tahalifa to Rav Yosef, I found a man and in his hand a scroll written in Assyrian script and in the holy language. I said to him, "From where did you get this?" He said to me, "I rented it from the Roman soldiers, and I found it among the treasures of Rome." And it is written in it, "After four thousand two hundred and ninety-one years from the creation of the world, the world will be orphaned. From them are the wars of sea monsters, from them are the wars of Gog and Magog and the rest of the days of the Messiah. And the Holy One, blessed be He, will not renew His world until after seven thousand years." Rav Acha, son of Raba, said, "After five thousand years it was stated."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא רַבִּי נָתָן אוֹמֵר מִקְרָא זֶה נוֹקֵב וְיוֹרֵד עַד תְּהוֹם 'כִּי עוֹד חֲזוֹן לַמּוֹעֵד וְיָפֵחַ לַקֵּץ וְלֹא יְכַזֵּב אִם יִתְמַהְמָהּ חַכֵּה לוֹ כִּי בֹא יָבֹא לֹא יְאַחֵר'
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Natan says: This verse penetrates and descends until the depths; “For the vision is yet for the appointed time; and it declares of the end, and does not lie; though it tarry, wait for it, because it will surely come; it will not delay”
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Nathan says, "This verse pierces and descends to the depths: 'For still the vision awaits its appointed time; it hastens to the end—it will not lie. If it seems slow, wait for it; it will surely come; it will not delay.'"

hebrew_text: לֹא כְּרַבּוֹתֵינוּ שֶׁהָיוּ דּוֹרְשִׁין 'עַד עִדָּן עִדָּנִין וּפְלַג עִדָּן'
human_translation: not in accordance with our Rabbis, who would interpret “For a period and periods and a half period”
llm_translation: Not like our predecessors who used to expound "until the time of times and half a time."

hebrew_text: וְלָא כְּרַבִּי שִׂמְלַאי שֶׁהָיָה דּוֹרֵשׁ 'הֶאֱכַלְתָּם לֶחֶם דִּמְעָה וַתַּשְׁקֵמוֹ בִּדְמָעוֹת שְׁלִישׁ'
human_translation: And not in accordance with Rabbi Simlai, who would interpret “You have fed them with the bread of tears and have given them tears to drink in great measure [ shalish ]”
llm_translation: And not like Rabbi Simlai who used to expound, "You have fed them the bread of tears and made them drink tears in large measure."

hebrew_text: וְלָא כְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא שֶׁהָיָה דּוֹרֵשׁ 'עוֹד אַחַת מְעַט הִיא וַאֲנִי מַרְעִישׁ אֶת הַשָּׁמַיִם וְאֶת הָאָרֶץ'
human_translation: And not in accordance with Rabbi Akiva, who would interpret “Yet once, it is a little while, and I will shake the heavens and the earth”
llm_translation: "And not like Rabbi Akiva who was expounding, 'Yet a little while, and I will shake the heavens and the earth.'"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מַלְכוּת (רִאשׁוֹן) [רִאשׁוֹנָה] שִׁבְעִים שָׁנָה מַלְכוּת שְׁנִיָּה חֲמִשִּׁים וּשְׁתַּיִם וּמַלְכוּת בֶּן כּוֹזֵיבָא שְׁתֵּי שָׁנִים וּמֶחֱצָה
human_translation: Rather, the first, monarchy seventy years. The second kingdom, fifty-two and the monarchy of bar Koziva, two and a half years.
llm_translation: Rather, kingdom (first) firstly seventy years, kingdom second fifty and two, and kingdom of Ben Koziba two years and half.

hebrew_text: מַאי וְיָפֵחַ לַקֵּץ וְלֹא יְכַזֵּב אָמַר רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן תִּיפַּח עַצְמָן שֶׁל מְחַשְּׁבֵי קִיצִּין שֶׁהָיוּ אוֹמְרִים כֵּיוָן שֶׁהִגִּיעַ (אֶת) הַקֵּץ וְלֹא בָּא שׁוּב אֵינוֹ בָּא אֶלָּא חַכֵּה לוֹ שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר אִם יִתְמַהְמָהּ חַכֵּה לוֹ שֶׁמָּא תֹּאמַר אָנוּ מְחַכִּין וְהוּא אֵינוֹ מְחַכֶּה  תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר וְלָכֵן יְחַכֶּה ה' לַחֲנַנְכֶם וְלָכֵן יָרוּם לְרַחֶמְכֶם
human_translation: What “And it declares [ veyafe’aḥ ] of the end, and does not lie”? Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani says Rabbi Yonatan says: May those who calculate the end of days be cursed [ tippaḥ ], as they would say once the end arrived and did not come, he will no longer come Rather, wait for his as it is stated: “Though it tarry, wait for it.” Lest you say we are awaiting and is not awaiting the verse states: “And therefore will the Lord wait, to be gracious to you; and therefore will He be exalted, to have mercy upon you;
llm_translation: What is "and He will make it beautiful at the end, and it will not lie"? Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said in the name of Rabbi Yonatan: The bones of the calculating ones will be made beautiful at the end, for they used to say, "Once the end arrives and does not come, it will never come." Rather, wait for it, as it is stated, "If it delays, wait for it, for it will surely come; it will not be late." Therefore, the Lord waits to be gracious to you, and therefore He will be exalted to show you mercy.

hebrew_text: וְכִי מֵאַחַר שֶׁאָנוּ מְחַכִּים וְהוּא מְחַכֶּה מִי מְעַכֵּב מִדַּת הַדִּין מְעַכֶּבֶת וְכִי מֵאַחַר שֶׁמִּדַּת הַדִּין מְעַכֶּבֶת אָנוּ לָמָּה מְחַכִּין לְקַבֵּל שָׂכָר שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר אַשְׁרֵי כׇּל חוֹכֵי לוֹ
human_translation: since we are awaiting and is awaiting who is preventing the attribute of judgment prevents And since the attribute of judgment prevents why do we await to receive a reward as it is stated: “Happy are all they who wait for Him.”
llm_translation: And when we are waiting, and he is waiting, who is delaying the judgment? The judgment delays. And when the judgment delays, why are we waiting to receive reward, as it is said, "Blessed are all who wait for Him."

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי לָא פָּחֵית עָלְמָא מִתְּלָתִין וְשִׁיתָּא צַדִּיקֵי דִּמְקַבְּלִי אַפֵּי שְׁכִינָה בְּכֹל דָּרָא שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר אַשְׁרֵי כׇּל חוֹכֵי לוֹ לוֹ בְּגִימַטְרִיָּא תְּלָתִין וְשִׁיתָּא הָווּ אִינִי וְהָאָמַר רָבָא דָּרָא דְּקַמֵּי קוּדְשָׁא בְּרִיךְ הוּא תַּמְנֵי סְרֵי אַלְפֵי פַּרְסָה הָוֵאי שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר סָבִיב שְׁמֹנָה עָשָׂר אָלֶף לָא קַשְׁיָא הָא דְּמִסְתַּכְּלִי בְּאִיסְפַּקְלַרְיָא הַמְּאִירָה הָא דְּמִסְתַּכְּלִי בְּאִיסְפַּקְלַרְיָא שֶׁאֵינָהּ מְאִירָה
human_translation: Abaye said: The world no fewer than thirty-six righteous in each generation who greet the Divine Presence, as it is stated: “Happy are all they who wait for Him [ lo ]” The numerical value of lo , is thirty-six. Is that so? But doesn’t Rava say: The row before the Holy One, Blessed be He, eighteen thousand parasangs, as it is stated “It shall be eighteen thousand reeds round about, not difficult; this who view through a luminous crystal [ be’ispaklarya ], that who view through a crystal that is not luminous.
llm_translation: Abaye said: The world was not created except for thirty and six righteous individuals who receive the presence of the Divine in every generation, as it is stated, "Blessed are all who wait for Him" (Isaiah 30:18). In gematria, thirty and six correspond to the word "I" (אֲנִי). And Rava said: The world that stands before the Holy One, blessed be He, is sustained by thirty-two righteous individuals, as it is stated, "Around Him, eighteen thousand" (Psalms 68:18), which is not difficult: this refers to those who contemplate in a clear lens that illuminates, and this refers to those who contemplate in a cloudy lens that does not illuminate.

hebrew_text: וּמִי נְפִישִׁי כּוּלֵּי הַאי וְהָאָמַר חִזְקִיָּה אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַי רָאִיתִי בְּנֵי עֲלִיָּיה וְהֵן מוּעָטִין אִם אֶלֶף הֵם  אֲנִי וּבְנִי מֵהֶם אִם מֵאָה הֵם  אֲנִי וּבְנִי מֵהֶם אִם שְׁנַיִם הֵם  אֲנִי וּבְנִי הֵם
human_translation: And are so numerous? But doesn’t Ḥizkiyya say Rabbi Yirmeya says in the name of Rabbi Shimon bar Yoḥai: I have seen members of prominent, and they are few. If they one thousand, I and my son are among them. If they one hundred, I and my son are among them; if they two, I and my son are they.
llm_translation: And who is greater than all these? And Hezekiah said, Rabbi Yirmiyah said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai: I have seen the children of the upper class, and they are few. If they are a thousand, I and my son are among them; if they are a hundred, I and my son are among them; if they are two, I and my son are they.

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא הָא דְּעָיְילִי בְּבַר הָא דְּעָיְילִי בְּלָא בַּר
human_translation: not difficult. This who enter by permission [ bar ] That who enter without permission,
llm_translation: Not difficult. This that ascend in a pit, this that ascend without a pit.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב כָּלוּ כׇּל הַקִּיצִּין וְאֵין הַדָּבָר תָּלוּי אֶלָּא בִּתְשׁוּבָה וּמַעֲשִׂים טוֹבִים  וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר דַּיּוֹ לָאָבֵל שֶׁיַּעֲמוֹד בְּאֶבְלוֹ כְּתַנָּאֵי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר אִם יִשְׂרָאֵל עוֹשִׂין תְּשׁוּבָה  נִגְאָלִין וְאִם לָאו  אֵין נִגְאָלִין אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אִם אֵין עוֹשִׂין תְּשׁוּבָה אֵין נִגְאָלִין אֶלָּא הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא מַעֲמִיד לָהֶן מֶלֶךְ שֶׁגְּזֵרוֹתָיו קָשׁוֹת כְּהָמָן וְיִשְׂרָאֵל עוֹשִׂין תְּשׁוּבָה וּמַחְזִירָן לְמוּטָב
human_translation: Rav says: All the ends passed, and the matter depends only upon repentance and good deeds. And Shmuel says: It is sufficient for the mourner to endure in his mourning parallel to tanna’im : Rabbi Eliezer says: If the Jewish people repent they are redeemed, and if not they are not redeemed. Rabbi Yehoshua said to him: If they do not repent, will they not be redeemed Rather, the Holy One, Blessed be He, will establish a king for them whose decrees are as harsh as Haman, and the Jewish people repent, and restore them to right
llm_translation: Rav said: All the calamities are dependent only on repentance and good deeds. And Shmuel said: It is enough for the mourner to stand in his mourning. Like the teachings of Rabbi Eliezer who said: If the Israelites repent, they are redeemed; and if not, they are not redeemed. Rabbi Yehoshua said to him: If they do not repent, they are not redeemed, but the Holy One, blessed be He, establishes for them a king whose decrees are as harsh as Haman's, and the Israelites repent and are brought back to the good.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא אִידַּךְ רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר אִם יִשְׂרָאֵל עוֹשִׂין תְּשׁוּבָה  נִגְאָלִין שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר 'שׁוּבוּ בָּנִים שׁוֹבָבִים אֶרְפָּא מְשׁוּבֹתֵיכֶם' אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ וַהֲלֹא כְּבָר נֶאֱמַר 'חִנָּם נִמְכַּרְתֶּם וְלֹא בְכֶסֶף תִּגָּאֵלוּ' 'חִנָּם נִמְכַּרְתֶּם'  בַּעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה וְלֹא בְּכֶסֶף תִּגָּאֵלוּ'  לֹא בִּתְשׁוּבָה וּמַעֲשִׂים טוֹבִים
human_translation: It is taught another Rabbi Eliezer says: If the Jewish people repent they are redeemed, as it is stated: “Return, wayward children, I will heal your iniquities” Rabbi Yehoshua said to him: But isn’t it already stated: You were sold for naught, and without money you shall be redeemed” “You were sold for naught” for idol worship, “And without money you shall be redeemed” not through repentance and good deeds,
llm_translation: It was taught in another Baraita: Rabbi Eliezer says, "If the Israelites repent, they will be redeemed, as it is stated, 'Return, O backsliding children, I will heal your backslidings.'" Rabbi Yehoshua said to him, "But hasn't it already been said, 'You were sold for nothing, and you shall be redeemed without money'? 'You were sold for nothing' - in idolatry, and 'you shall be redeemed without money' - not through repentance and good deeds."

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר לְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ וַהֲלֹא כְּבָר נֶאֱמַר 'שׁוּבוּ אֵלַי וְאָשׁוּבָה אֲלֵיכֶם' אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ וַהֲלֹא כְּבָר נֶאֱמַר 'כִּי אָנֹכִי בָּעַלְתִּי בָכֶם וְלָקַחְתִּי אֶתְכֶם אֶחָד מֵעִיר וּשְׁנַיִם מִמִּשְׁפָּחָה וְהֵבֵאתִי אֶתְכֶם צִיּוֹן'
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer said to Rabbi Yehoshua: But isn’t it already stated: “Return to me and I will return to you” Rabbi Yehoshua said to him: But isn’t it already stated: “For I have taken you to Myself; and I will take you one from a city and two from a family, and I will bring you to Zion”
llm_translation: He said to him Rabbi Eliezer to Rabbi Yehoshua, "But hasn't it already been said, 'Return to Me, and I will return to you'?" Rabbi Yehoshua said to him, "But hasn't it already been said, 'For I have taken you, one from a city and two from a family, and I will bring you to Zion'."

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר וַהֲלֹא כְּבָר נֶאֱמַר 'בְּשׁוּבָה וָנַחַת תִּוָּשֵׁעוּן' אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ לְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר וַהֲלֹא כְּבָר נֶאֱמַר כֹּה אָמַר ה' גֹּאֵל יִשְׂרָאֵל קְדוֹשׁוֹ לִבְזֹה נֶפֶשׁ לִמְתָעֵב גּוֹי לְעֶבֶד מֹשְׁלִים
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer said to him: But isn’t it already stated: “In ease [ beshuva ] and rest shall you be saved” Rabbi Yehoshua said to Rabbi Eliezer: But isn’t it already stated: “So says the Lord, Redeemer of Israel, his Holy One, to him who is despised of man, to him who is abhorred of the nation, to a servant of rulers:
llm_translation: He said to him Rabbi Eliezer, "But hasn't it already been said, 'In returning and rest you shall be saved'?" Rabbi Yehoshua said to Rabbi Eliezer, "But hasn't it already been said, 'Thus says the Lord, the Redeemer of Israel, his Holy One, to him who is despised in soul, to him who is abhorred by the nations, to a servant of rulers'."

hebrew_text: מְלָכִים יִרְאוּ וָקָמוּ שָׂרִים וְיִשְׁתַּחֲווּ'
human_translation: Kings shall see and arise, princes shall prostrate themselves,
llm_translation: Kings shall see and arise, princes, and they shall prostrate themselves.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר וַהֲלֹא כְּבָר נֶאֱמַר 'אִם תָּשׁוּב יִשְׂרָאֵל נְאֻם ה' אֵלַי תָּשׁוּב' אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ וַהֲלֹא כְּבָר נֶאֱמַר 'וָאֶשְׁמַע אֶת הָאִישׁ לְבוּשׁ הַבַּדִּים אֲשֶׁר מִמַּעַל לְמֵימֵי הַיְאֹר וַיָּרֶם יְמִינוֹ וּשְׂמֹאלוֹ אֶל הַשָּׁמַיִם וַיִּשָּׁבַע בְּחֵי הָעוֹלָם כִּי לְמוֹעֵד מוֹעֲדִים וָחֵצִי וּכְכַלּוֹת נַפֵּץ יַד עַם קֹדֶשׁ תִּכְלֶינָה כׇל אֵלֶּה' וְגוֹ' וְשָׁתַק רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer said to him: But isn’t it already stated: “If you will return, Israel, says the Lord, return to Me” Rabbi Yehoshua said to him: But isn’t it already stated: “And I heard the man clothed in linen, who was above the waters of the river, when he lifted up his right hand and his left hand to heaven and swore by the One Who lives forever that it shall be for a period, periods, and a half; when the crushing of the power of the holy people shall have been completed, all these And Rabbi Eliezer was silent,
llm_translation: He said to him Rabbi Eliezer, "But hasn't it already been said, 'If Israel returns, declares the Lord, return to Me'?" Rabbi Yehoshua said to him, "But hasn't it already been said, 'I heard the man dressed in linen, who was above the waters of the river, and he raised his right hand and his left hand to heaven, and swore by Him who lives forever, that it will be for a time, times, and half a time, and when the power of the holy people is shattered, all these will be completed' and so on." Rabbi Eliezer remained silent.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא אֵין לְךָ קֵץ מְגוּלֶּה מִזֶּה שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וְאַתֶּם הָרֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל עַנְפְּכֶם תִּתֵּנוּ וּפֶרְיְכֶם תִּשְׂאוּ לְעַמִּי יִשְׂרָאֵל וְגוֹ' רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר אַף מִזֶּה שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר כִּי לִפְנֵי הַיָּמִים (הָאֵלֶּה) [הָהֵם] שְׂכַר הָאָדָם לֹא נִהְיָה וּשְׂכַר הַבְּהֵמָה אֵינֶנָּה וְלַיּוֹצֵא וְלַבָּא אֵין שָׁלוֹם מִן הַצָּר
human_translation: And Rabbi Abba says: You have no explicit end than this as it is stated: “But you, mountains of Israel, you shall give your branches, and yield your fruit to My people of Israel, Rabbi Eliezer says: than this as well, as it is stated: “For before these days there was no hire for man, nor any hire for beast; nor was there peace from the oppressor to him who exits and to him who enters”
llm_translation: And Rabbi Abba said: You have no revealed end from this, as it is stated, "But you, O mountains of Israel, shall give forth your branch and yield your fruit for My people Israel" (Ezekiel 36:8). And Rabbi Eliezer says: Also from this, as it is stated, "For before those days there was no wage for man, nor any wage for beast; neither was there any peace for him who went out or came in because of the adversary" (Zechariah 8:10).

hebrew_text: מַאי לַיּוֹצֵא וְלַבָּא אֵין שָׁלוֹם מִן הַצָּר רַב אָמַר אַף תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים שֶׁכָּתוּב בָּהֶם שָׁלוֹם דִּכְתִיב שָׁלוֹם רָב לְאֹהֲבֵי תוֹרָתֶךָ אֵין שָׁלוֹם מִפְּנֵי צָר וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר עַד שֶׁיִּהְיוּ כׇּל הַשְּׁעָרִים כּוּלָּן שְׁקוּלִין
human_translation: What “Nor was there peace from the oppressor to him who exits and to him who enters”? Rav says: even Torah scholars, with regard to whom peace is written, as it is written: “Great peace have they who love Your Torah; there will be no peace from the oppressor. And Shmuel says: until all the prices are equal.
llm_translation: What is the meaning of "peace to the one who goes out and to the one who comes in"? There is no peace from the enemy. Rav said: Even the students of the sages, about whom it is written "great peace to those who love Your Torah," there is no peace because of the enemy. And Samuel said: Until all the gates are weighed.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא אֵין בֶּן דָּוִד בָּא עַד שֶׁיִּתְבַּקֵּשׁ דָּג [קָטָן] לְחוֹלֶה וְלֹא יִמָּצֵא שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר אָז אַשְׁקִיעַ מֵימֵיהֶם וְנַהֲרוֹתָם כַּשֶּׁמֶן אוֹלִיךְ וּכְתִיב בָּתְרֵיהּ בַּיּוֹם הַהוּא אַצְמִיחַ קֶרֶן לְבֵית יִשְׂרָאֵל
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina says: The son of David will not come until a fish will be sought for an ill person and will not be found, as it is stated “Then I will make their waters clear and cause their rivers to run like oil” And it is written thereafter: “On that day I will cause the glory of the house of Israel to flourish”
llm_translation: Rabbi Chanina said: The son of David will not come until a small fish is sought for a sick person and is not found, as it is stated, "Then I will make their waters bitter, and their rivers a desolation; for the wickedness of the inhabitants of the land" (Micah 6:13). And it is written further, "In that day I will raise up the fallen booth of David" (Amos 9:11) for the house of Israel.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חָמָא בַּר חֲנִינָא אֵין בֶּן דָּוִד בָּא עַד שֶׁתִּכְלֶה מַלְכוּת הַזָּלָה מִיִּשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וְכָרַת הַזַּלְזַלִּים בַּמַּזְמֵרוֹת וּכְתִיב בָּתְרֵיהּ בָּעֵת הַהִיא יוּבַל שַׁי לַה' צְבָאוֹת עַם מְמֻשָּׁךְ וּמוֹרָט
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥama bar Ḥanina says: The son of David will not come until the contemptuous [ hazalla ] kingdom will cease from the Jewish people, as it is stated: “And He shall sever the sprigs [ hazalzallim ] with pruning hooks” And it is written thereafter: “At that time shall a present be brought to the Lord of hosts, by a people scattered and hairless”
llm_translation: Rabbi Chama bar Chanina said: The son of David will not come until the kingdom of the impudent is finished from Israel, as it is stated, "And I will cut off the pride of the Philistines" (Zechariah 9:6), and it is written afterwards, "In that day shall a present be brought unto the Lord of hosts of a people tall and smooth" (Isaiah 18:7).

hebrew_text: אָמַר זְעֵירִי אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא אֵין בֶּן דָּוִד בָּא עַד שֶׁיִּכְלוּ גַּסֵּי הָרוּחַ מִיִּשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר כִּי אָז אָסִיר מִקִּרְבֵּךְ עַלִּיזֵי גַּאֲוָתֵךְ וּכְתִיב וְהִשְׁאַרְתִּי בְקִרְבֵּךְ עַם עָנִי וָדָל וְחָסוּ בְּשֵׁם ה'
human_translation: Ze’eiri says Rabbi Ḥanina says: The son of David will not come until the arrogant will cease from the Jewish people, as it is stated: “For then I will remove from your midst your proudly exulting ones” and it is written “And I will leave in your midst a poor and lowly people, and they shall take refuge in the name of the Lord”
llm_translation: Zei'iri said, Rabbi Chanina said: The son of David will not come until the arrogant ones of Israel are finished, as it is said, "For then I will remove from your midst your proud, exultant ones." And it is written, "And I will leave in your midst a humble and lowly people, and they will trust in the name of the Lord."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי שִׂמְלַאי מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אֵין בֶּן דָּוִד בָּא עַד שֶׁיִּכְלוּ כׇּל שׁוֹפְטִים וְשׁוֹטְרִים מִיִּשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וְאָשִׁיבָה יָדִי עָלַיִךְ וְאֶצְרֹף כַּבֹּר סִיגָיִךְ וְגוֹ' וְאָשִׁיבָה שֹׁפְטַיִךְ
human_translation: Rabbi Simlai says in the name of Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon: The son of David will not come until all the judges and officers will cease from the Jewish people, as it is stated: “And I will turn My hand against you and purge away your dross as with lye And I will restore your judges
llm_translation: Rabbi Shmueli said in the name of Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Shimon: The son of David will not come until all the judges and officers from the people of Israel will be finished, as it is stated, "And I will restore your judges as at first, and your counselors as at the beginning" (Isaiah 1:26).

hebrew_text: אָמַר עוּלָּא אֵין יְרוּשָׁלָיִם נִפְדֵּית אֶלָּא בִּצְדָקָה שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר צִיּוֹן בְּמִשְׁפָּט תִּפָּדֶה וְשָׁבֶיהָ בִּצְדָקָה אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא אִי בָּטְלִי יְהִירֵי  בָּטְלִי אַמְגּוּשֵׁי אִי בָּטְלִי דַּיָּינֵי  בָּטְלִי גְּזִירְפָּטֵי אִי בָּטְלִי יְהִירֵי בָּטְלִי אַמְגּוּשֵׁי דִּכְתִיב וְאֶצְרֹף כַּבֹּר סִיגָיִךְ וְאָסִירָה כׇּל בְּדִילָיִךְ וְאִי בָּטְלִי דַּיָּינֵי בָּטְלִי גְּזִירְפָּטֵי דִּכְתִיב הֵסִיר ה' מִשְׁפָּטַיִךְ פִּנָּה אֹיְבֵךְ
human_translation: Ulla says: Jerusalem is redeemed only by means of righteousness, as it is stated: “Zion shall be redeemed with justice and those who return to it with righteousness” Rav Pappa says: If the arrogant will cease the sorcerers will cease If the judges cease the royal officers [ gazirpatei ] will cease If the arrogant will cease, the sorcerers will cease, as it is written: “And I will purge away your dross [ sigayikh ] as with lye, and I will remove all your alloy [ bedilayikh ].” And if the judges cease the royal officers will cease as it is written: “The Lord has removed your judgments; cast out your enemy”
llm_translation: Ulla said: Jerusalem is redeemed only through charity, as it is stated, "Zion shall be redeemed with justice, and those who return to her with righteousness." Rav Papa said: If the arrogant are nullified, the arrogant are nullified; if the haughty are nullified, the haughty are nullified; if the judges of falsehood are nullified, the judges of falsehood are nullified; if the arrogant are nullified, the haughty are nullified, as it is written, "And I will turn My hand upon you, and purge away your dross as with lye, and take away all your alloy." And if the judges of falsehood are nullified, the judges of falsehood are nullified, as it is written, "The Lord has taken away your judgments, He has cast out your enemy."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אִם רָאִיתָ דּוֹר שֶׁמִּתְמַעֵט וְהוֹלֵךְ חַכֵּה לוֹ שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וְאֶת עַם עָנִי תּוֹשִׁיעַ וְגוֹ' אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אִם רָאִיתָ דּוֹר שֶׁצָּרוֹת רַבּוֹת בָּאוֹת עָלָיו כַּנָּהָר  חַכֵּה לוֹ שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר כִּי יָבֹא כַנָּהָר צָר (וְ)רוּחַ ה' נֹסְסָה בוֹ וּסְמִיךְ לֵיהּ וּבָא לְצִיּוֹן גּוֹאֵל
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: If you saw a generation whose is steadily diminishing, await as it is stated: “And the afflicted people You will redeem” Rabbi Yoḥanan says: If you saw a generation troubles inundate it like a river, await as it is stated: “When distress will come like a river that the breath of the Lord drives” And juxtaposed to it “And a redeemer will come to Zion”
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yochanan: If you see a generation that is diminishing and deteriorating, wait for him, as it is stated, "And You save an afflicted people" (Psalms 18:28). Rabbi Yochanan said: If you see a generation upon which numerous troubles come like a river, wait for him, as it is stated, "When the enemy shall come in like a flood, the spirit of the Lord shall lift up a standard against him" (Isaiah 59:19), and it is adjacent to it, "And He shall come to Zion as a redeemer."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אֵין בֶּן דָּוִד בָּא אֶלָּא בְּדוֹר שֶׁכּוּלּוֹ זַכַּאי אוֹ כּוּלּוֹ חַיָּיב בְּדוֹר שֶׁכּוּלּוֹ זַכַּאי  דִּכְתִיב וְעַמֵּךְ כֻּלָּם צַדִּיקִים לְעוֹלָם יִירְשׁוּ אָרֶץ בְּדוֹר שֶׁכּוּלּוֹ חַיָּיב דִּכְתִיב וַיַּרְא כִּי אֵין אִישׁ וַיִּשְׁתּוֹמֵם כִּי אֵין מַפְגִּיעַ וּכְתִיב לְמַעֲנִי אֶעֱשֶׂה
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan says: The son of David will come only in a generation that is entirely innocent, or entirely guilty, in a generation that is entirely innocent, as it is written: “And your people also shall be all righteous; they shall inherit the land forever” in a generation that is entirely guilty, as it is written: “And He saw that there was no man, and was astonished that there was no intercessor; And it is written: for My own sake will I do it;
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yochanan said: The son of David will only come in a generation that is entirely meritorious or entirely guilty. As it is written, "And your people shall all be righteous; they shall inherit the land forever." In a generation that is entirely guilty, as it is written, "And He saw that there was no man, and He was astonished that there was no intercessor; so His arm brought about salvation for Him."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֲלֶכְּסַנְדְּרִי רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי רָמֵי כְּתִיב בְּעִתָּהּ וּכְתִיב אֲחִישֶׁנָּה זָכוּ  אֲחִישֶׁנָּה לֹא זָכוּ  בְּעִתָּהּ
human_translation: Rabbi Alexandri says: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi raises a contradiction it is written: “In its time,” and it is written: “I will hasten it,” If they merit I will hasten If they do not merit in its time.
llm_translation: Rabbi Alexandri said, Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi raised a contradiction: It is written "at its appointed time" and it is written "I will hasten it." If they merit, I will hasten it; if they do not merit, at its appointed time.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֲלֶכְּסַנְדְּרִי רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי רָמֵי כְּתִיב וַאֲרוּ עִם עֲנָנֵי שְׁמַיָּא כְּבַר אֱנָשׁ אָתֵה וּכְתִיב עָנִי וְרֹכֵב עַל חֲמוֹר זָכוּ  עִם עֲנָנֵי שְׁמַיָּא לֹא זָכוּ  עָנִי וְרוֹכֵב עַל חֲמוֹר
human_translation: Rabbi Alexandri says: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi raises a contradiction It is written: “There came with the clouds of heaven, one like unto a son of man… And it is written: lowly and riding upon a donkey If merit with the clouds of heaven. If they do not merit lowly and riding upon a donkey.
llm_translation: Rabbi Alexandri said, Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi raises a contradiction: It is written, "And they saw the God of Israel" (Exodus 24:10), likening God to a young man, and it is written, "Poor and riding on a donkey" (Zechariah 9:9), indicating that with the angels of heaven they did not merit to see God, but a poor man riding on a donkey did.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ שַׁבּוּר מַלְכָּא לִשְׁמוּאֵל אָמְרִיתוּ מָשִׁיחַ עַל חַמְרָא אָתֵי אֵישַׁדַּר לֵיהּ סוּסְיָא בָּרְקָא דְּאִית לִי אֲמַר לֵיהּ מִי אִית לָךְ בַּר חֵיוַר גַּוְונֵי
human_translation: King Shapur said to Shmuel You say Messiah come on a donkey; I will send him the riding [ barka ] horse that I have. said to him: Do you have with one thousand colors [ bar ḥivar gavanei ]
llm_translation: He said to him, Shabur the king to Shmuel, "You said the Messiah will come upon a donkey?" I will send to him a horse of lightning that I have." He said to him, "Do you have a son of a wild ass, a male of colors?"

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי אַשְׁכַּח לְאֵלִיָּהוּ (דְּהָוֵי קָיְימִי) [דַּהֲוָה קָאֵי] אַפִּיתְחָא דִּמְעָרְתָּא דְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַאי אֲמַר לֵיהּ אָתֵינָא לְעָלְמָא דְּאָתֵי אֲמַר לֵיהּ אִם יִרְצֶה אָדוֹן הַזֶּה אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי שְׁנַיִם רָאִיתִי וְקוֹל שְׁלֹשָׁה שָׁמַעְתִּי
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi found Elijah who was standing at the entrance of the cave of Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai. said to him: Will I come to the World-to-Come? said to him: If this Master, will wish Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi says: Two I saw, and the voice of three I heard,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi found Elijah (as he was standing) at the entrance of the cave of Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai. He said to him, "When will the Messiah come?" He replied, "Go and ask him yourself." Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi asked, "Where is he sitting?" Elijah answered, "At the entrance of the city." Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi asked, "What is his sign by which I may recognize him?" Elijah replied, "He is sitting among the poor lepers. They all untie their bandages at once and then re-tie them, whereas he unties and re-ties each bandage separately, thinking, 'Should I be summoned, I must not be delayed.'"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אֵימַת אָתֵי מָשִׁיחַ אָמַר לֵיהּ זִיל שַׁיְילֵיהּ לְדִידֵיהּ וְהֵיכָא יָתֵיב אַפִּיתְחָא דְּרוֹמִי וּמַאי סִימָנֵיהּ יָתֵיב בֵּינֵי עַנְיֵי סוֹבְלֵי חֳלָאִים וְכוּלָּן שָׁרוּ וְאָסְירִי בְּחַד זִימְנָא אִיהוּ שָׁרֵי חַד וְאָסַיר חַד אָמַר דִּילְמָא מִבְּעֵינָא דְּלָא אִיעַכַּב
human_translation: said to When Messiah come? said to him: Go ask him. And where is he sitting? At the entrance of Rome. And what is his sign He sits among the poor who suffer from illnesses. And all of them untie and tie at once, unties one and ties one He says: Perhaps I will be needed that I will not be delayed.
llm_translation: He said to him, "When will the Messiah come?" He said to him, "Go and ask him himself." And where does he sit? He sits at the entrance of Rome. And what are the signs of his coming? He sits among the poor who suffer from diseases, and all of them bandage and unbandage themselves all at once. But when he sees that perhaps he is needed, he delays.

hebrew_text: אֲזַל לְגַבֵּיהּ אֲמַר לֵיהּ שָׁלוֹם עָלֶיךָ רַבִּי וּמוֹרִי אֲמַר לֵיהּ שָׁלוֹם עָלֶיךָ בַּר לֵיוַאי אֲמַר לֵיהּ לְאֵימַת אָתֵי מָר אֲמַר לֵיהּ הַיּוֹם אֲתָא לְגַבֵּי אֵלִיָּהוּ אֲמַר לֵיהּ מַאי אֲמַר לָךְ אֲמַר לֵיהּ שָׁלוֹם עָלֶיךָ בַּר לֵיוַאי אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבְטְחָךְ לָךְ וְלַאֲבוּךְ לְעָלְמָא דְּאָתֵי אֲמַר לֵיהּ שַׁקּוֹרֵי קָא שַׁקַּר בִּי דַּאֲמַר לִי 'הַיּוֹם אָתֵינָא' וְלָא אֲתָא אֲמַר לֵיהּ הָכִי אָמַר לָךְ 'הַיּוֹם אִם בְּקֹלוֹ תִשְׁמָעוּ'
human_translation: went to He said to Greetings to you, my rabbi and my teacher. said to him: Greetings to you, bar Leva’i. said to him: When will the Master come? said to him: Today. came to Elijah. said to him: What did say to you? He said to Greetings [ shalom ] to you, bar Leva’i. said to him: guaranteed you and your father the World-to-Come, said to lied to me, as he said to me: I am coming today, and he did not come. said to him this he said to you: “today, if you will listen to his voice”
llm_translation: He went to meet him, he said to him, "Peace be upon you, Rabbi and my teacher." He said to him, "Peace be upon you, son of Levi." He said to him, "When will the Master come?" He said to him, "Today." He went to meet Elijah, he said to him, "What did he say to you?" He said to him, "Peace be upon you, son of Levi." He said to him, "Trust for yourself and for your father in the world to come." He said to him, "False prophets deceive me, for he said to me, 'Today I will come,' and he did not come." He said to him, "This is what he said to you, 'Today, if you will listen to his voice.'"

hebrew_text: שָׁאֲלוּ תַּלְמִידָיו אֶת רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בֶּן קִיסְמָא אֵימָתַי בֶּן דָּוִד בָּא אָמַר מִתְיָירֵא אֲנִי שֶׁמָּא תְּבַקְּשׁוּ מִמֶּנִּי אוֹת אָמְרוּ לוֹ אֵין אָנוּ מְבַקְּשִׁין מִמְּךָ אוֹת
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei ben Kisma’s students asked him: When will the son of David come? said: I am hesitant lest you request from me a sign They said to him: We are not asking you for a sign.
llm_translation: The disciples asked Rabbi Yosei ben Kisma: "When will the son of David come?" He replied: "I am afraid that you will demand a sign from me." They said to him: "We do not ask a sign from you."

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָהֶם לִכְשֶׁיִּפּוֹל הַשַּׁעַר הַזֶּה וְיִבָּנֶה וְיִפּוֹל וְיִבְנֶה וְיִפּוֹל וְאֵין מַסְפִּיקִין לִבְנוֹתוֹ עַד שֶׁבֶּן דָּוִד בָּא אָמְרוּ לוֹ רַבֵּינוּ תֵּן לָנוּ אוֹת אָמַר לָהֶם וְלֹא כָּךְ אֲמַרְתֶּם לִי שֶׁאֵין אַתֶּם מְבַקְּשִׁין מִמֶּנִּי אוֹת
human_translation: said to them: when this gate falls and will be rebuilt, and will fall and will be rebuilt, and will fall And they will not manage to rebuild it until the son of David comes. said to him: Our rabbi, give us a sign. said to them: But didn’t you say to me that you are not asking me for a sign?
llm_translation: He said to them, "When this gate falls and is rebuilt, and falls and is rebuilt, and falls and there are not enough to rebuild it until the son of David comes," they said to him, "Our teacher, give us a sign." He said to them, "And this is not what you said to me, that you are not seeking a sign from me."

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ לוֹ וְאַף עַל פִּי כֵן אָמַר לָהֶם אִם כָּךְ יֵהָפְכוּ מֵי מְעָרַת פַּמְיָיס לְדָם וְנֶהֶפְכוּ לְדָם
human_translation: They said to him: And nevertheless, said to them: If it is the water of the Cave of Pamyas will be transformed into blood. And was transformed into blood.
llm_translation: They said to him, and even so he said to them, "If so, let the waters of the cave of Pamyas turn to blood, and they turned to blood."

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁעַת פְּטִירָתוֹ אָמַר לָהֶן הַעֲמִיקוּ לִי אֲרוֹנִי
human_translation: At the time of his death, said to Place my coffin deep
llm_translation: At the time of his passing, he said to them, "Bury my coffin deeply."

hebrew_text: שֶׁאֵין כׇּל דֶּקֶל וָדֶקֶל שֶׁבְּבָבֶל שֶׁאֵין סוּס שֶׁל פָּרְסִיִּים נִקְשָׁר בּוֹ וְאֵין לָךְ כׇּל אָרוֹן וְאָרוֹן שֶׁבְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁאֵין סוּס מָדִי אוֹכֵל בּוֹ תֶּבֶן
human_translation: as there is no palm that is in Babylonia to which a horse of the Persians will not be tethered And there is no coffin in Eretz Yisrael from which a Median horse will not eat straw.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "That there is no palm tree in Babylon, that a Persian horse is not tied to it, and that you have no chest in the land of Israel that a Median horse eats straw."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אֵין בֶּן דָּוִד בָּא עַד שֶׁתִּתְפַּשֵּׁט מַלְכוּת הָרְשָׁעָה עַל יִשְׂרָאֵל תִּשְׁעָה חֳדָשִׁים שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר לָכֵן יִתְּנֵם עַד עֵת יוֹלֵדָה יָלָדָה וְיֶתֶר אֶחָיו יְשׁוּבוּן עַל בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל
human_translation: Rav says: The son of David will not come until the evil kingdom will disperse throughout Eretz Yisrael for nine months, as it is stated: “Therefore will He give them up, until the time when she who is in labor has given birth; then the remnant of his brethren shall return with the children of Israel”
llm_translation: Rav said: The son of David will not come until the wicked kingdom spreads over Israel for nine months, as it is stated, "Therefore will He give them up, until the time that she who travails has brought forth; then the residue of his brothers shall return with the children of Israel."

hebrew_text: אָמַר עוּלָּא יֵיתֵי וְלָא אִיחְמִינֵיהּ וְכֵן אָמַר [רַבָּה] יֵיתֵי וְלָא אִיחְמִינֵיהּ רַב יוֹסֵף אָמַר יֵיתֵי וְאֶזְכֵּי דְּאֵיתֵיב בְּטוּלָּא דְּכוּפִיתָא דַּחֲמָרֵיהּ
human_translation: Ulla says: Let come, but I will not see him, Likewise, Rabba says: Let come, but I will not see him. Rav Yosef says: Let come, and I will be privileged to sit in the shadow of his donkey’s excrement.
llm_translation: Ula said: Let him sit, and do not prevent him. And similarly, Rabba said: Let him sit, and do not prevent him. Rav Yosef said: Let him sit, and I will merit that he is sitting on the overturned barrel of his wine.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי לְרַבָּה מַאי טַעְמָא אִילֵּימָא מִשּׁוּם חֶבְלוֹ שֶׁל מָשִׁיחַ וְהָתַנְיָא שָׁאֲלוּ תַּלְמִידָיו אֶת רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר מָה יַעֲשֶׂה אָדָם וְיִנָּצֵל מֵחֶבְלוֹ שֶׁל מָשִׁיחַ יַעֲסוֹק בְּתוֹרָה וּבִגְמִילוּת חֲסָדִים וּמָר הָא תּוֹרָה וְהָא גְּמִילוּת חֲסָדִים
human_translation: Abaye said to Rabba: What is the reason If we say it is due to the pains of the Messiah, but isn’t it taught students asked Rabbi Elazar: What shall a person do to be spared from the pains of Messiah? Rabbi Elazar They shall engage in Torah and acts of kindness. And the Master isn’t there Torah and aren’t there acts of kindness
llm_translation: He said to him, Abaye to Rabah, what is the reason? If you say because of the birth pangs of the Messiah, but it has been taught: His disciples asked Rabbi Eliezer, what should a person do to be saved from the birth pangs of the Messiah? Engage in Torah study and acts of loving-kindness. And some say, Torah study and acts of loving-kindness.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ שֶׁמָּא יִגְרוֹם הַחֵטְא כִּדְרַבִּי יַעֲקֹב בַּר אִידִי דְּרַבִּי יַעֲקֹב בַּר אִידִי רָמֵי כְּתִיב וְהִנֵּה אָנֹכִי עִמָּךְ וּשְׁמַרְתִּיךָ בְּכֹל אֲשֶׁר תֵּלֵךְ וּכְתִיב וַיִּירָא יַעֲקֹב מְאֹד וַיֵּצֶר לוֹ
human_translation: said to him: lest sin cause in accordance with of Rabbi Ya’akov bar Idi. As Rabbi Ya’akov bar Idi raises a contradiction. It is written “And I am with you, and will keep you wherever you go” and it is written: “And Jacob was greatly afraid and distressed”
llm_translation: He said to him, perhaps the sin will cause as Rabbi Yaakov bar Idi said, as Rabbi Yaakov bar Idi raised a contradiction: It is written, "Behold, I am with you, and I will guard you wherever you go," and it is written, "And Yaakov was very afraid and distressed him."

hebrew_text: שֶׁהָיָה מִתְיָירֵא שֶׁמָּא יִגְרוֹם הַחֵטְא כִּדְתַנְיָא 'עַד יַעֲבֹר עַמְּךָ ה'  זוֹ בִּיאָה רִאשׁוֹנָה 'עַד יַעֲבֹר עַם זוּ קָנִית'  זוֹ בִּיאָה שְׁנִיָּה
human_translation: He was afraid lest sin cause as it is taught “Until Your people pass over, Lord”; this is the first entry “Until Your people, whom You have acquired, pass over”; this is the second entry
llm_translation: He was afraid lest the sin be caused, as it is taught: "Until your people, O Lord, pass by" - this refers to the first intercourse. "Until this people, whom You have acquired" - this refers to the second intercourse.

hebrew_text: אֱמוֹר מֵעַתָּה רְאוּיִים הָיוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל לַעֲשׂוֹת לָהֶם נֵס בְּבִיאָה שְׁנִיָּה כְּבִיאָה רִאשׁוֹנָה אֶלָּא שֶׁגָּרַם הַחֵטְא
human_translation: Say from now, the Jewish people were worthy to perform a miracle on their in the second entry like the first entry but the sin caused
llm_translation: Say from now fitting were Israel to do for them miracle in coming second like coming first but caused the sin

hebrew_text: וְכֵן אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן יֵיתֵי וְלָא אִיחְמִינֵיהּ אֲמַר לֵיהּ רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ מַאי טַעְמָא אִילֵּימָא מִשּׁוּם דִּכְתִיב כַּאֲשֶׁר יָנוּס אִישׁ מִפְּנֵי הָאֲרִי וּפְגָעוֹ הַדֹּב [וּבָא הַבַּיִת] וְסָמַךְ יָדוֹ עַל הַקִּיר וּנְשָׁכוֹ הַנָּחָשׁ בֹּא וְאַרְאֶךָּ דּוּגְמָתוֹ בָּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה בִּזְמַן שֶׁאָדָם יוֹצֵא לַשָּׂדֶה וּפָגַע בּוֹ סַנְטָר  דּוֹמֶה כְּמִי שֶׁפָּגַע בּוֹ אֲרִי נִכְנַס לָעִיר פָּגַע בּוֹ גַּבַּאי  דּוֹמֶה כְּמִי שֶׁפְּגָעוֹ דֹּב נִכְנַס לְבֵיתוֹ וּמָצָא בָּנָיו וּבְנוֹתָיו מוּטָלִין בָּרָעָב  דּוֹמֶה כְּמִי שֶׁנְּשָׁכוֹ נָחָשׁ
human_translation: And so Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Let come, but I will not see him. Reish Lakish said to him: What is the reason If we say it is because it is written “As when a man did flee from a lion and a bear met him, or went into the house and leaned his arm on the wall and a snake bit him” Come, and I will show you a counterpart in this world At a time when a person goes out to the field and is accosted by a guard [ santar ] is similar to one who is accosted by a lion. He enters the city and is accosted by tax collector. is similar to one who is accosted by a bear. He enters his house and finds his sons and daughters afflicted with famine. is similar to one whom a snake bit.
llm_translation: And so said Rabbi Yochanan: Let him come, and I will not be afraid of him. Reish Lakish said to him: What is the reason? If we say it is because it is written, "As when a man flees from a lion, and a bear meets him, or goes home, leans his hand against the wall, and a snake bites him" (Amos 5:19), come and I will show you his likeness in this world: When a person goes out to the field and is met by a robber, he is like one who is met by a lion. If he enters the city and is met by a tax collector, he is like one who is met by a bear. If he enters his house and finds his sons and daughters hungry, it is like one who is bitten by a snake.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מִשּׁוּם דִּכְתִיב שַׁאֲלוּ נָא וּרְאוּ אִם יֹלֵד זָכָר מַדּוּעַ רָאִיתִי כׇל גֶּבֶר יָדָיו עַל חֲלָצָיו כַּיּוֹלֵדָה וְנֶהֶפְכוּ כׇל פָּנִים לְיֵרָקוֹן
human_translation: Rather, that it is written “Ask now, and see whether a man gives birth. Why, then, do I see every man [ kol gever ] with his hands on his loins, as a woman in labor, and all faces turned green?”
llm_translation: Rather, because it is written, "Ask now, and see, if a male gives birth, why do I see every man with his hands on his loins like a woman in labor, and all faces have turned pale?"

hebrew_text: מַאי רָאִיתִי כָּל גֶּבֶר אָמַר רָבָא בַּר יִצְחָק אָמַר רַב מִי שֶׁכׇּל גְּבוּרָה שֶׁלּוֹ וּמַאי וְנֶהֶפְכוּ כׇל פָּנִים לְיֵרָקוֹן אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן פָּמַלְיָא שֶׁל מַעְלָה וּפָמַלְיָא שֶׁל מַטָּה בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁאָמַר הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא הַלָּלוּ מַעֲשֵׂה יָדַי וְהַלָּלוּ מַעֲשֵׂה יָדַי הֵיאַךְ אֲאַבֵּד אֵלּוּ מִפְּנֵי אֵלּוּ
human_translation: What “I see kol gever ”? Rava bar Yitzḥak says Rav says: He Whom all strength is His. And what “And all faces turned green”? Rabbi Yoḥanan says: entourage above, and entourage below, at the time when the Holy One, Blessed be He, says: These, are My handiwork, and those, are My handiwork. How shall I destroy those on account of these?
llm_translation: What did I see? Every man said Rava bar Yitzchak said Rav: Who is the one whose might is his, and what is "and all faces turned green"? Rabbi Yochanan said: The upper chamber and the lower chamber at the moment when the Holy One, blessed be He, said, "These are My handiwork, and these are My handiwork." How can I destroy these for the sake of those?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא הַיְינוּ דְּאָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי רָהֵיט וְנָפֵל תּוֹרָא וְאָזֵיל וְשָׁדֵי לֵיהּ סוּסְיָא בְּאוּרְיֵיהּ
human_translation: Rav Pappa says this that people say: An ox runs and falls, and goes and casts a horse in its place.
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: This is what people say, "A potter falls and a Torah scroll is broken, and he goes and saddles his horse with it."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב גִּידֵּל אָמַר רַב עֲתִידִין יִשְׂרָאֵל דְּאָכְלִי שְׁנֵי מָשִׁיחַ אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף פְּשִׁיטָא וְאֶלָּא מַאן אָכֵיל לְהוּ חִילָק וּבִילָק אָכְלִי לְהוּ לְאַפּוֹקֵי מִדְּרַבִּי הִילֵּל דְּאָמַר אֵין מָשִׁיחַ לְיִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁכְּבָר אֲכָלוּהוּ בִּימֵי חִזְקִיָּה
human_translation: Rav Giddel says Rav says: The Jewish people are destined to eat the years of Messiah. Rav Yosef says: obvious? And rather, who will eat them? Ḥillak and Billak, eat them? to exclude Rabbi Hillel, who says: There is no Messiah for the Jewish people, as they already ate him, during the days of Hezekiah.
llm_translation: Rav Giddel said, Rav said, "In the future, the people of Israel will eat from the two Messiahs." Rav Yosef said, "It is obvious, rather, who will eat for them? Hezekiah and Bilam will eat for them, to fulfill the words of Rabbi Hillel who said, 'There is no Messiah for Israel, as they have already eaten him in the days of Hezekiah.'"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב לָא אִבְּרִי עָלְמָא אֶלָּא לְדָוִד וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר לְמֹשֶׁה וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר לְמָשִׁיחַ
human_translation: Rav says: The world was created only for David, And Shmuel says: Moses. And Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Messiah.
llm_translation: Rav said: "The world was not created except for David and Samuel." And Rabbi Yochanan said: "For Moses." And Rabbi Yochanan said: "For the Messiah."

hebrew_text: מָה שְׁמוֹ דְּבֵי רַבִּי שֵׁילָא אָמְרִי שִׁילֹה שְׁמוֹ שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר עַד כִּי יָבֹא שִׁילֹה דְּבֵי רַבִּי יַנַּאי אָמְרִי יִנּוֹן שְׁמוֹ שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר יְהִי שְׁמוֹ לְעוֹלָם לִפְנֵי שֶׁמֶשׁ יִנּוֹן שְׁמוֹ דְּבֵי רַבִּי חֲנִינָה אָמְרִ[י] חֲנִינָה שְׁמוֹ שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר אֲשֶׁר לֹא אֶתֵּן לָכֶם חֲנִינָה וְיֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים מְנַחֵם בֶּן חִזְקִיָּה שְׁמוֹ שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר כִּי רָחַק מִמֶּנִּי מְנַחֵם מֵשִׁיב נַפְשִׁי וְרַבָּנַן אָמְרִי חִיוּוֹרָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי שְׁמוֹ שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר אָכֵן חֳלָיֵינוּ הוּא נָשָׂא וּמַכְאֹבֵינוּ סְבָלָם וַאֲנַחְנוּ חֲשַׁבְנֻהוּ נָגוּעַ מֻכֵּה אֱלֹהִים וּמְעֻנֶּה
human_translation: What is his name? The school of Rabbi Sheila says: Shiloh is his name, as it is stated: “Until when Shiloh shall come” The school of Rabbi Yannai says: Yinnon is his name, as it is stated: “May his name endure forever; may his name continue [ yinnon ] as long as the sun; The school of Rabbi Ḥanina says: Ḥanina is his name, as it is stated: “For I will show you no favor [ ḥanina ]” And some say Menaḥem ben Ḥizkiyya is his name, as it is stated: “Because the comforter [ menaḥem ] that should relieve my soul is far from me” And the Rabbis say: The leper of the house of Rabbi is his name, as it is stated: “Indeed our illnesses he did bear and our pains he endured; yet we did esteem him injured, stricken by God, and afflicted”
llm_translation: The name of the house of Rabbi Sheilah said: Shiloh is his name, as it is stated, "Until Shiloh comes." The name of the house of Rabbi Yannai said: Yinnon is his name, as it is stated, "May his name endure forever; may his name be continued as long as the sun." The name of the house of Rabbi Chanina said: Chanina is his name, as it is stated, "Which I will not give you, Chanina." And some say: Menachem the son of Hezekiah is his name, as it is stated, "For Menachem is far from me, the one who restores my soul." And the Rabbis say: Chivyura of the house of Rabbi is his name, as it is stated, "Surely our sickness he has borne, and our pains he carried; but we considered him plagued, smitten by God, and afflicted."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אִי מִן חַיַּיָּא הוּא כְּגוֹן אֲנָא שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וְהָיָה אַדִּירוֹ מִמֶּנּוּ וּמֹשְׁלוֹ מִקִּרְבּוֹ יָצָא אָמַר רַב אִי מִן חַיַּיָּא הוּא כְּגוֹן רַבֵּינוּ הַקָּדוֹשׁ אִי מִן מִתַיָּא הוּא כְּגוֹן דָּנִיֵּאל אִישׁ חֲמוּדוֹת
human_translation: Rav Naḥman says: If is among the living such as me, as it is stated: “And their prince shall be of themselves, and their governor shall proceed from their midst” Rav says: If is among the living such as our saintly Rabbi If is among the dead such as Daniel, the beloved man.
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said: If he is from the living, for example, myself, as it is stated, "And his majestic one is from him, and his ruler shall come forth from within him." Rav said: If he is from the living, for example, our holy teacher. If he is from the dead, for example, Daniel, a man of desires.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב עָתִיד הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לְהַעֲמִיד לָהֶם דָּוִד אַחֵר שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וְעָבְדוּ אֵת ה' אֱלֹהֵיהֶם וְאֵת דָּוִד מַלְכָּם אֲשֶׁר אָקִים לָהֶם הֵקִים לֹא נֶאֱמַר אֶלָּא אָקִים אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב פָּפָּא לְאַבָּיֵי וְהָכְתִיב וְדָוִד עַבְדִּי נָשִׂיא לָהֶם לְעוֹלָם כְּגוֹן קֵיסָר וּפַלְגֵי קֵיסָר
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Rav says: The Holy One, Blessed be He, is destined to establish another David as it is stated: “And they shall serve the Lord their God, and David their king, whom I will establish for them” It is not stated: I established, but “I will establish,” Rav Pappa said to Abaye: But isn’t it written: “And my servant David shall be their prince forever” like an emperor and a viceroy;
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: The Holy One, blessed be He, will in the future establish for them another David, as it is stated, "And they shall serve the Lord their God, and David their king, whom I will raise up for them" (Jeremiah 30:9). It does not say "whom I have raised," but rather "whom I will raise." Rav Papa said to Abbaye: But it is written, "And David shall be their prince forever" (Ezekiel 37:25), like Caesar and the Caesars.

hebrew_text: דָּרַשׁ רַבִּי שִׂמְלַאי מַאי דִּכְתִיב הוֹי הַמִּתְאַוִּים אֶת יוֹם ה' לָמָּה זֶּה לָכֶם יוֹם ה' הוּא חֹשֶׁךְ וְלֹא אוֹר  מָשָׁל לְתַרְנְגוֹל וַעֲטַלֵּף שֶׁהָיוּ מְצַפִּין לָאוֹר אֲמַר לֵיהּ תַּרְנְגוֹל לַעֲטַלֵּף אֲנִי מְצַפֶּה לָאוֹרָה  שֶׁאוֹרָה שֶׁלִּי הִיא וְאַתָּה לָמָּה לְךָ אוֹרָה
human_translation: Rabbi Simlai taught: What which is written: “Woe to you who desire the day of the Lord. Why would you have this day of the Lord? It is darkness, and not light” comparable to a rooster and a bat who were looking forward to light The rooster said to the bat: I look forward to light, as light is my But you, why do you light?
llm_translation: Rabbi Simlai expounded: What is the meaning of the verse, "Woe to those who desire the day of the Lord! Why should you want the day of the Lord? It is darkness, not light" (Amos 5:18). This can be compared to a rooster and a bat that were awaiting the light. The rooster said to the bat, "I am waiting for the light, for the light is mine, but why do you need the light?"

hebrew_text: וְהַיְינוּ דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ הָהוּא מִינָא לְרַבִּי אֲבָהוּ אֵימָתַי אָתֵי מָשִׁיחַ אָמַר לֵיהּ לְכִי חָפֵי לְהוּ חֲשׁוֹכָא לְהָנְהוּ אִינָשֵׁי אֲמַר לֵיהּ מֵילָט קָא לָיְיטַתְּ לִי אֲמַר לֵיהּ קְרָא כְּתִיב 'כִּי הִנֵּה הַחֹשֶׁךְ יְכַסֶּה אֶרֶץ וַעֲרָפֶל לְאֻמִּים וְעָלַיִךְ יִזְרַח ה' וּכְבוֹדוֹ עָלַיִךְ יֵרָאֶה'
human_translation: And that is as a certain heretic said to Rabbi Abbahu: When will Messiah come? said to him: when the darkness will enshroud these people, said to him: you cursing me said to him, a verse is written: “For behold, the darkness shall cover the earth, and fog the peoples; but the Lord shall shine upon you, and His glory shall be seen upon you”
llm_translation: And that is what that Minna said to Rabbi Abbahu: "When will the Messiah come?" He said to him: "Go and ask the shadows of the people." He said to him: "You are mocking me." He said to him: "It is written, 'For behold, darkness shall cover the earth, and thick darkness the peoples; but upon you the Lord will shine, and His glory will be seen upon you.'"

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר יְמוֹת הַמָּשִׁיחַ אַרְבָּעִים שָׁנָה שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר 'אַרְבָּעִים שָׁנָה אָקוּט בְּדוֹר' רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה אוֹמֵר שִׁבְעִים שָׁנָה שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר 'וְהָיָה בַּיּוֹם הַהוּא וְנִשְׁכַּחַת צֹר שִׁבְעִים שָׁנָה כִּימֵי מֶלֶךְ אֶחָד' אֵיזֶהוּ מֶלֶךְ מְיוּחָד  הֱוֵי אוֹמֵר זֶה מָשִׁיחַ
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Eliezer says: The messianic era will be forty years as it is stated: “Forty years will I strive with the generation” Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya says: seventy years, as it is stated: “And it shall come to pass on that day, that Tyre shall be forgotten seventy years, according to the days of one king” Which is unique king? You must say this is Messiah.
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Eliezer says, "The days of the Messiah will be forty years, as it is stated, 'Forty years I was disgusted with that generation.'" Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah says, "Seventy years, as it is stated, 'And it shall be on that day that Tyre shall be forgotten seventy years, like the days of one king.' Which king is unique? You would say this is the Messiah."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אוֹמֵר שְׁלֹשָׁה דּוֹרוֹת שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר 'יִירָאוּךָ עִם שָׁמֶשׁ וְלִפְנֵי יָרֵחַ דּוֹר דּוֹרִים' רַבִּי הִילֵּל אוֹמֵר אֵין לָהֶם מָשִׁיחַ לְיִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁכְּבָר אֲכָלוּהוּ בִּימֵי חִזְקִיָּה
human_translation: Rabbi says: three generations, as it is stated: “May they fear You as long as the sun and moon endure, throughout the generations [ dor dorim ]” Rabbi Hillel says: There is no Messiah for the Jewish people, as they already ate him, during the days of Hezekiah.
llm_translation: Rabbi says: three generations, as it is stated, "They shall fear you with the sun, and before the moon, generation of generations." Rabbi Hillel says: Israel has no Messiah, as they have already consumed him in the days of Hezekiah.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף שְׁרָא לֵיהּ מָרֵיהּ לְרַבִּי הִילֵּל חִזְקִיָּה אֵימַת הֲוָה  בְּבַיִת רִאשׁוֹן וְאִילּוּ זְכַרְיָה קָא מִתְנַבֵּי בְּבַיִת שֵׁנִי וְאָמַר גִּילִי מְאֹד בַּת צִיּוֹן הָרִיעִי בַּת יְרוּשָׁלִַים הִנֵּה מַלְכֵּךְ יָבוֹא לָךְ צַדִּיק וְנוֹשָׁע הוּא עָנִי וְרֹכֵב עַל חֲמוֹר וְעַל עַיִר בֶּן אֲתֹנוֹת
human_translation: Rav Yosef says: May the Master forgive Rabbi Hillel Hezekiah, when was during the First Temple Whereas Zechariah prophesied during the Second Temple and said: “Rejoice greatly, daughter of Zion; shout, daughter of Jerusalem; behold, your king will come to you; he is just and victorious; lowly and riding upon a donkey and upon a colt, the foal of a donkey”
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: "The Master permitted Rabbi Hillel to marry Hizkiyah. When was this? In the first house. But when Zachariah began prophesying in the second house, he said, 'Rejoice greatly, O daughter of Zion! Shout, O daughter of Jerusalem! Behold, your king comes to you; righteous and victorious, lowly and riding upon a donkey, even upon a colt, the foal of a donkey.'"

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא אִידַּךְ רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר יְמוֹת הַמָּשִׁיחַ אַרְבָּעִים שָׁנָה  כְּתִיב הָכָא 'וַיְעַנְּךָ וַיַּרְעִבֶךָ וַיַּאֲכִלְךָ' וּכְתִיב הָתָם 'שַׂמְּחֵנוּ כִּימוֹת עִנִּיתָנוּ שְׁנוֹת רָאִינוּ רָעָה'
human_translation: It is taught another Rabbi Eliezer says: The messianic era forty years It is written here “And He afflicted you, and suffered you to hunger and fed you and it is written there: “Make us glad according to the days that You afflicted us, the years that we saw evil”
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: The other one, Rabbi Eliezer says: The days of the Messiah will be forty years. It is written here, "He afflicted you and made you hungry and fed you," and it is written there, "Make us rejoice as many days as You have afflicted us, the years we have seen evil."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי דּוֹסָא אוֹמֵר אַרְבַּע מֵאוֹת שָׁנָה כְּתִיב הָכָא 'וַעֲבָדוּם וְעִנּוּ אֹתָם אַרְבַּע מֵאוֹת שָׁנָה' וּכְתִיב הָתָם 'שַׂמְּחֵנוּ כִּימוֹת עִנִּיתָנוּ'
human_translation: Rabbi Dosa says: four hundred years. It is written here “And they shall serve them, and they shall afflict them four hundred years” and it is written there: “Make us glad according to the days that You afflicted us.”
llm_translation: Rabbi Dosa says: Four hundred years is written here, "And they shall serve them and afflict them four hundred years," and it is written there, "Make us rejoice as the days you afflicted us."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אוֹמֵר שְׁלֹשׁ מֵאוֹת וְשִׁשִּׁים וְחָמֵשׁ שָׁנָה כְּמִנְיַן יְמוֹת הַחַמָּה שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר 'כִּי יוֹם נָקָם בְּלִבִּי וּשְׁנַת גְּאוּלַי בָּאָה'
human_translation: Rabbi says: 365 years, corresponding to the number of days of the solar as it is stated: “For the day of vengeance is in My heart, and the year of My redeemed is come”
llm_translation: Rabbi says three hundred and sixty-five years like the count of the days of the sun, as it is said, "For the day of vengeance is in My heart, and the year of My redemption has come."

hebrew_text: מַאי יוֹם נָקָם בְּלִבִּי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן לְלִבִּי גִּלִּיתִי לְאֵבָרַיי לֹא גִּלִּיתִי רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ אָמַר לְלִבִּי גִּלִּיתִי לְמַלְאֲכֵי הַשָּׁרֵת לֹא גִּלִּיתִי
human_translation: What “For the day of vengeance is in My heart”? Rabbi Yoḥanan says I revealed to My heart, I did not reveal to My limbs, Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish says I revealed to My heart, I did not reveal the ministering angels.
llm_translation: "What is 'a day of vengeance in my heart'? Rabbi Yochanan said: 'I revealed it to my heart, but not to my limbs.' Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: 'I revealed it to my heart, but not to the ministering angels.'"

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי אֲבִימִי בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי אֲבָהוּ יְמוֹת הַמָּשִׁיחַ לְיִשְׂרָאֵל שִׁבְעַת אֲלָפִים שָׁנָה שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר 'וּמְשׂוֹשׂ חָתָן עַל כַּלָּה כֵּן יָשִׂישׂ עָלַיִךְ אֱלֹהֶיךָ'
human_translation: Avimi, son of Rabbi Abbahu, taught: The messianic era for the Jewish people seven thousand years, as it is stated: “And as the bridegroom rejoices over the bride, so shall your God rejoice over you”
llm_translation: It was taught by Avimi, son of Rabbi Avahu: The days of the Messiah for Israel will be seven thousand years, as it is said, "And as the bridegroom rejoices over the bride, so shall your God rejoice over you."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל יְמוֹת הַמָּשִׁיחַ  כְּמִיּוֹם שֶׁנִּבְרָא הָעוֹלָם וְעַד עַכְשָׁיו שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר כִּימֵי הַשָּׁמַיִם עַל הָאָרֶץ
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: the messianic era is like from the day the world was created until now, as it is stated: as the days of heaven upon the earth”
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: The days of the Messiah are like the day that the world was created, as it is stated, "As the days of heaven upon the earth."

hebrew_text: רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק אָמַר כִּימֵי נֹחַ עַד עַכְשָׁיו שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר כִּי מֵי נֹחַ זֹאת לִי אֲשֶׁר נִשְׁבַּעְתִּי
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak says: the messianic era is like from the days of Noah until now, as it is stated “For this is as the seas of [ ki mei ] Noah to me; as I have sworn
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: "Like the days of Noah until now," as it is stated, "For the waters of Noah, this is for Me, as I have sworn."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן כׇּל הַנְּבִיאִים כּוּלָּן לֹא נִתְנַבְּאוּ אֶלָּא לִימוֹת הַמָּשִׁיחַ אֲבָל לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא עַיִן לֹא רָאָתָה אֱלֹהִים זוּלָתְךָ אֱלֹהִים יַעֲשֶׂה לִמְחַכֵּה לוֹ וּפְלִיגָא דִּשְׁמוּאֵל דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל אֵין בֵּין הָעוֹלָם הַזֶּה לִימוֹת הַמָּשִׁיחַ אֶלָּא שִׁעְבּוּד מַלְכִיּוֹת בִּלְבַד
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: all the prophets prophesied only about the messianic era, but with regard to the World-to-Come “No eye has seen it, God, aside from You, Who will do for those who await Him” And disagrees with of Shmuel, as Shmuel says: The between this world and the messianic era is only servitude to kingdoms alone,
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Chiya bar Abba said Rabbi Yochanan: All the prophets, all of them, prophesied only for the days of the Messiah, but for the World to Come, "Eye has not seen, O God, except You, God, will do for one who waits for Him." And the dispute of Shmuel, for Shmuel said: "There is no difference between this world and the days of the Messiah, except for the subjugation of kingdoms alone."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן כׇּל הַנְּבִיאִים לֹא נִתְנַבְּאוּ אֶלָּא לְבַעֲלֵי תְשׁוּבָה אֲבָל צַדִּיקִים גְּמוּרִים עַיִן לֹא רָאָתָה אֱלֹהִים זוּלָתְךָ וּפְלִיגָא דְּרַבִּי אֲבָהוּ דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ אָמַר רַב מָקוֹם שֶׁבַּעֲלֵי תְשׁוּבָה עוֹמְדִין שָׁם צַדִּיקִים אֵינָן עוֹמְדִין שָׁם שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר שָׁלוֹם שָׁלוֹם לָרָחוֹק וְלַקָּרוֹב בְּרֵישָׁא רָחוֹק וַהֲדַר קָרוֹב מַאי רָחוֹק רָחוֹק דְּמֵעִיקָּרָא וּמַאי קָרוֹב קָרוֹב דְּמֵעִיקָּרָא וּדְהַשְׁתָּא
