human_translation: And Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: All of the prophets prophesied only with regard to penitents, but with regard to the completely righteous “No eye has seen it, God, aside from You.” And this disagrees with of Rabbi Abbahu, as Rabbi Abbahu says Rav says: In the place where penitents stand, the completely righteous do not stand, as it is stated: “Peace, peace upon him who is far and him who is near” first him who is far, and thereafter him who is near. What far”? initially far, And what near”? initially near and at present,
llm_translation: And Rabbi Hiyya bar Abba said in the name of Rabbi Yohanan: All the prophets prophesied only for those who have repented, but completely righteous individuals, no eye has seen except for You, God. And it is a dispute of Rabbi Abbahu, for Rabbi Abbahu said in the name of Rav: In a place where penitents stand, the completely righteous do not stand, as it is stated, "Peace, peace to the far and to the near" - the far first and then the near. What is considered far? Far from the beginning. And what is considered near? Near from the beginning. And now...

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר לָרָחוֹק  שֶׁהוּא רָחוֹק מֵעֲבֵירָה קָרוֹב  שֶׁהוּא קָרוֹב מֵעֲבֵירָה וְנִתְרַחֵק מִמֶּנָּה
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan says: “Upon him who is far” who is distant from transgression, near” who is near to transgression and distanced from it,
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yochanan said to the distant one, that he is distant from transgression, the close one, that he is close to transgression, and distance oneself from it.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן כׇּל הַנְּבִיאִים כּוּלָּן לֹא נִתְנַבְּאוּ אֶלָּא לְמַשִּׂיא בִּתּוֹ לְתַלְמִיד חָכָם וּלְעוֹשֶׂה פְּרַקְמַטְיָא לְתַלְמִיד חָכָם וְלִמְהַנֶּה תַּלְמִיד חָכָם מִנְּכָסָיו אֲבָל תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים עַצְמָן עַיִן לֹא רָאָתָה אֱלֹהִים זוּלָתְךָ
human_translation: And Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: All of the prophets prophesied only with regard to one who marries his daughter to a Torah scholar, and to one who conducts business [ perakmatya ] on behalf of a Torah scholar, and to one who to benefit a Torah scholar from his property But Torah scholars themselves, “No eye has seen it, God, aside from You.”
llm_translation: And said Rabbi Chiya bar Abba said Rabbi Yochanan: All the prophets, all of them, were only prophesied for the sake of providing a wife to a Torah scholar, and for providing a cloak for a Torah scholar, and for providing a purse for a Torah scholar. And why does a Torah scholar need these things from his possessions? But the Torah scholars themselves, God has not seen anything besides them.

hebrew_text: מַאי עַיִן לֹא רָאָתָה אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי זֶה יַיִן הַמְשׁוּמָּר בַּעֲנָבָיו מִשֵּׁשֶׁת יְמֵי בְּרֵאשִׁית רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר זֶה עֵדֶן [שֶׁ]לֹּא רָאֲתָה עַיִן מֵעוֹלָם וְאִם תֹּאמַר אָדָם הֵיכָן דָּר  בַּגָּן וְאִם תֹּאמַר גַּן הוּא עֵדֶן  תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר וְנָהָר יֹצֵא מֵעֵדֶן לְהַשְׁקוֹת אֶת הַגָּן
human_translation: What “no eye has seen it”? Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi says: This is wine preserved in its grapes from the six days of Creation. Reish Lakish says: This is Eden, no eye has ever seen. And if you say: Where did Adam live, in the garden. And lest you say: garden is Eden the verse states: “And a river emerged from Eden to irrigate the garden”
llm_translation: What is "an eye that has not seen"? Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: This refers to wine that has been preserved in its grapes since the six days of Creation. Resh Lakish said: This is the Eden that no eye has ever seen. And if you say, "Where did Adam dwell?" - in the garden. And if you say, "Is the garden Eden?" - the verse teaches, "And a river goes out of Eden to water the garden."

hebrew_text: וְהָאוֹמֵר 'אֵין תּוֹרָה מִן הַשָּׁמַיִם' וְכוּ' תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן 'כִּי דְבַר ה' בָּזָה וּמִצְוָתוֹ הֵפַר הִכָּרֵת תִּכָּרֵת' זֶה הָאוֹמֵר אֵין תּוֹרָה מִן הַשָּׁמַיִם דָּבָר אַחֵר 'כִּי דְבַר ה' בָּזָה'  זֶה אֶפִּיקוֹרוֹס
human_translation: And one who says: Torah not from Heaven. The Sages taught “Because he has despised the word of the Lord and has breached His commandment; shall be excised; this one who says: Torah not from Heaven. Alternatively, “Because he has despised the word of the Lord”; this an epikoros ,
llm_translation: The one who says, 'The Torah is not from heaven,' etc. The Rabbis taught: "For he has despised the word of the Lord, and has broken His commandment, that soul shall utterly be cut off" - this is the one who says, 'The Torah is not from heaven.' Another explanation: "For he has despised the word of the Lord" - this is the Epicurean.

hebrew_text: דָּבָר אַחֵר 'כִּי דְבַר ה' בָּזָה'  זֶה הַמְגַלֶּה פָּנִים בַּתּוֹרָה 'וְאֶת מִצְוָתוֹ הֵפַר'  זֶה הַמֵּפֵר בְּרִית בָּשָׂר 'הִכָּרֵת תִּכָּרֵת'  'הִכָּרֵת' בָּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה 'תִּכָּרֵת'  לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא מִכָּאן אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר הַמּוֹדָעִי הַמְחַלֵּל אֶת הַקֳּדָשִׁים וְהַמְבַזֶּה אֶת הַמּוֹעֲדוֹת וְהַמֵּפֵר בְּרִיתוֹ שֶׁל אַבְרָהָם אָבִינוּ וְהַמְגַלֶּה פָּנִים בְּתוֹרָה שֶׁלֹּא כַּהֲלָכָה וְהַמַּלְבִּין פְּנֵי חֲבֵירוֹ בָּרַבִּים אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁיֵּשׁ בְּיָדוֹ תּוֹרָה וּמַעֲשִׂים טוֹבִים אֵין לוֹ חֵלֶק לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא
human_translation: Alternatively, “Because he has despised the word of the Lord”; this one who interprets the Torah inappropriately. “And has breached His commandment”; this one who breaches the covenant of flesh, “Shall be excised [ hikkaret tikkaret ]”; “ hikkaret ” in this world, “ tikkaret ” from the World-to-Come. From here Rabbi Elazar HaModa’i says: one who desecrates consecrated and one who treats the Festivals with contempt; and one who breaches the covenant of Abraham our forefather; and one who reveals aspects in the Torah that are not in accordance with halakha ; and one who humiliates another in public, even if he has to his credit Torah and good deeds, he has no share in the World-to-Come.
llm_translation: Another interpretation: "He who despises the word of the Lord" - this refers to one who reveals the face in the Torah and violates His commandments. "He who breaks the covenant of flesh" - this refers to one who breaks the covenant of Abraham our father. "He shall be cut off" in this world, "he shall be cut off" in the world to come. From here Rabbi Eliezer HaModa'i said: One who desecrates sacred things, despises the festivals, violates the covenant of our father Abraham, reveals the face in the Torah not according to Halacha, and shames his fellow in public, even though he possesses Torah and good deeds, he has no portion in the world to come.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא אִידַּךְ 'כִּי דְבַר ה' בָּזָה' זֶה הָאוֹמֵר אֵין תּוֹרָה מִן הַשָּׁמַיִם וַאֲפִילּוּ אָמַר כׇּל הַתּוֹרָה כּוּלָּהּ מִן הַשָּׁמַיִם חוּץ מִפָּסוּק זֶה שֶׁלֹּא אֲמָרוֹ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא אֶלָּא מֹשֶׁה מִפִּי עַצְמוֹ זֶהוּ 'כִּי דְבַר ה' בָּזָה' וַאֲפִילּוּ אָמַר כׇּל הַתּוֹרָה כּוּלָּהּ מִן הַשָּׁמַיִם חוּץ מִדִּקְדּוּק זֶה מִקַּל וָחוֹמֶר זֶה מִגְּזֵרָה שָׁוָה זוֹ זֶה הוּא 'כִּי דְבַר ה' בָּזָה'
human_translation: It is taught another “Because he has despised the word of the Lord”; this is one who says Torah not from Heaven. And even one says the entire Torah from Heaven except for this verse, that the Holy One, Blessed be He, did not say it but Moses on his own, this is “Because he has despised the word of the Lord.” And even one says the entire Torah from Heaven except for this inference for this a fortiori for this verbal analogy, this is “Because he has despised the word of the Lord.”
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: The other one who is considered to be "despising the word of the Lord" is one who says, "The Torah is not from heaven," even if he says that the entire Torah is from heaven except for this verse, which the Holy One, blessed be He, did not say but Moses said on his own accord, this is considered to be "despising the word of the Lord." And even if he says that the entire Torah is from heaven except for this point of interpretation from a minor to a major, or this analogy from one verse to another, this is considered to be "despising the word of the Lord."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא הָיָה רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר הַלּוֹמֵד תּוֹרָה וְאֵינוֹ מְלַמְּדָהּ  זֶה הוּא 'דְּבַר ה' בָּזָה' רַבִּי נָתָן אוֹמֵר כׇּל מִי שֶׁאֵינוֹ מַשְׁגִּיחַ עַל הַמִּשְׁנָה רַבִּי נְהוֹרַאי אוֹמֵר כׇּל שֶׁאֶפְשָׁר לַעֲסוֹק בַּתּוֹרָה וְאֵינוֹ עוֹסֵק
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Meir would say: one who studies Torah and does not teach it this is “He has despised the word of the Lord,” Rabbi Natan says: Anyone who does not pay attention to the Mishna Rabbi Nehorai says: Anyone whom possible to engage in Torah and does not engage
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Meir would say, "One who learns Torah but does not teach it, this is 'despising the word of God.'" Rabbi Natan would say, "Anyone who does not pay attention to the Mishnah." Rabbi Nehorai would say, "Anyone who is able to engage in Torah study but does not do so."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל אוֹמֵר זֶה הָעוֹבֵד עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה מַאי מַשְׁמָעָה דְּתָנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל 'כִּי דְבַר ה' בָּזָה'  זֶה הַמְבַזֶּה דִּבּוּר שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר לוֹ לְמֹשֶׁה מִסִּינַי 'אָנֹכִי ה' אֱלֹהֶיךָ לֹא יִהְיֶה לְךָ אֱלֹהִים אֲחֵרִים' וְגוֹ'
human_translation: Rabbi Yishmael says: This an idol worshipper. where inferred? as the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: “Because he has despised the word [ devar ] of the Lord”; this one who treats with contempt a statement [ dibbur ] that was stated to Moses at Sinai “I am the Lord your God…You shall have no other gods
llm_translation: Rabbi Yishmael says: What is the implication of the Mishnah taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael, "For they have despised the word of the Lord"? This refers to one who despises speech, as it is said to Moses from Sinai, "I am the Lord your God, you shall have no other gods before Me," etc.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן קׇרְחָה אוֹמֵר כׇּל הַלּוֹמֵד תּוֹרָה וְאֵינוֹ חוֹזֵר עָלֶיהָ דּוֹמֶה לְאָדָם שֶׁזּוֹרֵעַ וְאֵינוֹ קוֹצֵר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר כׇּל הַלּוֹמֵד תּוֹרָה וּמְשַׁכְּחָהּ דּוֹמֶה לְאִשָּׁה שֶׁיּוֹלֶדֶת וְקוֹבֶרֶת
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korḥa says: Anyone who studies Torah and does not review it is comparable to a person who sows and does not reap. Rabbi Yehoshua says: Anyone who studies Torah and causes to forget it is similar to a woman who gives birth and buries
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korcha says: Anyone who learns Torah but does not review it is like a man who sows but does not reap. Rabbi Yehoshua says: Anyone who learns Torah and forgets it is like a woman who gives birth and buries her child.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva says:
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva says:

hebrew_text: זַמֵּר בְּכׇל יוֹם זַמֵּר בְּכׇל יוֹם אָמַר רַב יִצְחָק בַּר אֲבוּדִימִי מַאי קְרָא  שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר נֶפֶשׁ עָמֵל עָמְלָה לּוֹ כִּי אָכַף עָלָיו פִּיהוּ הוּא עָמֵל בִּמְקוֹם זֶה וְתוֹרָתוֹ עוֹמֶלֶת לוֹ בְּמָקוֹם אַחֵר
human_translation: Sing every day, sing every day, Rav Yitzḥak bar Avudimi says: what verse as it is stated: “The hunger of the laborer labors for him; for his mouth presses upon him” He labors in this place, and his Torah labors for him in another place,
llm_translation: Sang every day, sang every day. Rav Yitzchak bar Avudimi said: What is the verse? As it is said, "The soul that sins, it shall die; the son shall not bear the iniquity of the father with him, neither shall the father bear the iniquity of the son with him; the righteousness of the righteous shall be upon him, and the wickedness of the wicked shall be upon him."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר כׇּל אָדָם לְעָמָל נִבְרָא שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר כִּי אָדָם לְעָמָל יוּלָּד אֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ אִם לַעֲמַל פֶּה נִבְרָא אִם לַעֲמַל מְלָאכָה נִבְרָא  כְּשֶׁהוּא אוֹמֵר כִּי אָכַף עָלָיו פִּיהוּ הֱוֵי אוֹמֵר לַעֲמַל פֶּה נִבְרָא וַעֲדַיִין אֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ אִם לַעֲמַל תּוֹרָה אִם לַעֲמַל שִׂיחָה  כְּשֶׁהוּא אוֹמֵר לֹא יָמוּשׁ סֵפֶר הַתּוֹרָה הַזֶּה מִפִּיךָ הֱוֵי אוֹמֵר לַעֲמַל תּוֹרָה נִבְרָא וְהַיְינוּ דְּאָמַר רָבָא כּוּלְּהוּ גּוּפֵי דְּרוּפְתְּקֵי נִינְהוּ טוּבֵיהּ לִדְזָכֵי דְּהָוֵי דְּרוּפְתְּקֵי דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar says: Every man was created for labor, as it is stated: “Man is born for toil” I do not know whether he was created for toil of the mouth, whether he was created for the toil of labor. When states: “For his mouth presses upon him” you must say he was created for toil of the mouth. And still I do not know whether it is for the toil of Torah or for the toil of conversation. When states: “This Torah scroll shall not depart from your mouth” you must say he was created for the toil of Torah. And that is what Rava said: All bodies are like receptacles Happy is one who is privileged, who is a receptacle for Torah.
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: Every person was created for toil, as it is stated, "For man was born to toil" (Job 5:7). I do not know if he was created for toil of the mouth or for toil of labor. When it says, "If he imposes his mouth on him," one should say he was created for toil of the mouth. And still, I do not know if it is for toil of Torah or for toil of conversation. When it says, "Let this Torah scroll not depart from your mouth," one should say he was created for toil of Torah. And this is what Rava said: All those weak-bodied individuals, their goodness is for those who engage in Torah study.

hebrew_text: נֹאֵף אִשָּׁה חֲסַר לֵב אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ זֶה הַלּוֹמֵד תּוֹרָה לִפְרָקִים שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר כִּי נָעִים כִּי תִשְׁמְרֵם בְּבִטְנֶךָ יִכֹּנוּ יַחְדָּו עַל שְׂפָתֶיךָ
human_translation: “He who commits adultery with a woman lacks understanding” Reish Lakish says: This is one who studies Torah intermittently, as it is stated “For it is a pleasant thing if you keep them within your belly; let them be established on your lips”
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "He who commits adultery with a woman lacks understanding." Reish Lakish said: This refers to one who studies Torah in disjointed sections, as it is stated, "For they are pleasant if you keep them within you; they will be established together upon your lips."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן 'וְהַנֶּפֶשׁ אֲשֶׁר תַּעֲשֶׂה בְּיָד רָמָה' זֶה מְנַשֶּׁה בֶּן חִזְקִיָּה שֶׁהָיָה יוֹשֵׁב וְדוֹרֵשׁ בְּהַגָּדוֹת שֶׁל דּוֹפִי
human_translation: The Sages taught “But the person who acts high-handedly, this Manasseh ben Hezekiah, who would sit and teach flawed narratives.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: "And the soul that does with a high hand" - this is Menasheh son of Hizkiyahu, who would sit and expound on the Aggadot of Duppi.

hebrew_text: אָמַר 'וְכִי לֹא הָיָה לוֹ לְמֹשֶׁה לִכְתּוֹב אֶלָּא וַאֲחוֹת לוֹטָן תִּמְנָע וְתִמְנַע הָיְתָה פִילֶגֶשׁ לֶאֱלִיפַז וַיֵּלֶךְ רְאוּבֵן בִּימֵי קְצִיר חִטִּים וַיִּמְצָא דוּדָאִים בַּשָּׂדֶה' יָצְאָה בַּת קוֹל וְאָמְרָה לוֹ 'תֵּשֵׁב בְּאָחִיךָ תְדַבֵּר בְּבֶן אִמְּךָ תִּתֶּן דֹּפִי אֵלֶּה עָשִׂיתָ וְהֶחֱרַשְׁתִּי דִּמִּיתָ הֱיוֹת אֶהְיֶה כָמוֹךָ אוֹכִיחֲךָ וְאֶעֶרְכָה לְעֵינֶיךָ'
human_translation: said: But did Moses need to write only “And Lotan’s sister was Timna” “And Timna was concubine to Eliphaz, “And Reuben went in the days of the wheat harvest and found duda’im in the field” A Divine Voice emerged and said to him: “You sit and speak against your brother; you slander your own mother’s son. These things you have done, and should I have kept silence, you would imagine that I was like you, but I will reprove you, and set the matter before your eyes”
llm_translation: He said, "And was it not for Moses to write only 'And Timna was the sister of Lotan, Timna was a concubine to Eliphaz, and Reuben went in the days of the wheat harvest and found mandrakes in the field.' A Bat Kol came out and said to him, 'Sit with your brothers, speak about the son of your mother, give the likeness. You have done this, and I will be silent. You have likened me, I will be like you. I will rebuke you and set it before your eyes."

hebrew_text: וְעָלָיו מְפוֹרָשׁ בַּקַּבָּלָה 'הוֹי מֹשְׁכֵי הֶעָוֹן בְּחַבְלֵי הַשָּׁוְא וְכַעֲבוֹת הָעֲגָלָה חַטָּאָה' מַאי כַּעֲבוֹת הָעֲגָלָה אָמַר רַבִּי אַסִּי יֵצֶר הָרָע בַּתְּחִלָּה דּוֹמֶה לְחוּט שֶׁל כּוּבְיָא וּלְבַסּוֹף דּוֹמֶה לַעֲבוֹת הָעֲגָלָה
human_translation: And about it is stated explicitly in the tradition, “Woe unto them who draw iniquity with cords of vanity, and sin as with a cart rope” What “as with a cart rope”? Rabbi Asi says: the evil inclination. Initially, it seems like spinning [ kuveya ] thread and ultimately it seems like cart rope.
llm_translation: And it is explained in the Kabbalah: "Woe to those who draw iniquity with cords of falsehood, and as with cart ropes sin." What is "as with cart ropes sin"? Rabbi Assi said: The evil inclination at first is like a thread of spider's web, but in the end it is like the cart ropes of a wagon.

hebrew_text: דַּאֲתַן עֲלַהּ מִיהַת אֲחוֹת לוֹטָן תִּמְנָע מַאי הִיא תִּמְנַע בַּת מְלָכִים הֲוַאי דִּכְתִיב אַלּוּף לוֹטָן אַלּוּף תִּמְנָע וְכׇל אַלּוּף  מַלְכוּתָא בְּלָא תָּאגָא הִיא
human_translation: that we came to in any event, what is “And Lotan’s sister was Timna”? Timna was the daughter of kings, as it is written: “The chief of Lotan” “The chief of Timna” and each chief is a monarchy, without a crown.
llm_translation: The text: "D'atan alah mi'hat achot Lotan timna maai hi timna bat melachim hava'i dikhtiv aluf Lotan aluf Timna v'kol aluf malkhuta bela taga hi." Translation: "That Timna, who was a sister of Lotan, withheld what is she withholding? She is withholding the daughter of kings. This is the one of whom it is written, 'Duke Lotan, Duke Timna, and every duke of the kingdom without exception, she is.'"

hebrew_text: בָּעֲיָא לְאִיגַּיּוֹרֵי בָּאתָה אֵצֶל אַבְרָהָם יִצְחָק וְיַעֲקֹב וְלֹא קִבְּלוּהָ הָלְכָה וְהָיְתָה פִילֶגֶשׁ לֶאֱלִיפַז בֶּן עֵשָׂו אָמְרָה מוּטָב תְּהֵא שִׁפְחָה לְאוּמָּה זוֹ וְלֹא תְּהֵא גְּבִירָה לְאוּמָּה אַחֶרֶת נְפַק מִינַּהּ עֲמָלֵק דְּצַעֲרִינְהוּ לְיִשְׂרָאֵל מַאי טַעְמָא  דְּלָא אִיבְּעִי לְהוּ לְרַחוֹקַהּ
human_translation: sought to convert. She came before Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, and they did not accept her. She went and became a concubine of Eliphaz, son of Esau, and said, It is preferable that she will be a maidservant for this nation, and she will not be a noblewoman for another nation. Amalek, emerged from her, afflicted the Jewish people. What is the reason that they should not have rejected her
llm_translation: The question of the Aggadite: She came to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, and they did not accept her as a legal wife. She became a concubine to Eliphaz, the son of Esau. She said, "It is better for me to be a maidservant to this nation and not to be a mistress to another nation." From her, Amalek descended, who caused distress to the Israelites. What is the reason that she did not want to go far away from them?

hebrew_text: וַיֵּלֶךְ רְאוּבֵן בִּימֵי קְצִיר חִטִּים אָמַר רָבָא בְּרַבִּי יִצְחָק אָמַר רַב מִכָּאן לְצַדִּיקִים שֶׁאֵין פּוֹשְׁטִין יְדֵיהֶן בְּגָזֵל וַיִּמְצָא דּוּדָאִים בַּשָּׂדֶה מַאי דּוּדָאִים אָמַר רַב יַבְרוּחֵי לֵוִי אָמַר סִיגְלֵי רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן אָמַר סְבִיסְקֵי
human_translation: “And Reuben went in the days of the wheat harvest” Rava, son of Rabbi Yitzḥak, says Rav says: From here that the righteous do not extend their hands in robbery “And he found duda’im in the field.” What are duda’im ? Rav says: yavruḥei . Levi says: violets. Rabbi Yonatan says: seviskei .
llm_translation: Reuven went in the days of the wheat harvest. Rava said in the name of Rabbi Yitzchak, Rav said: From here we learn about the righteous that they do not stretch out their hands in theft. And he found mandrakes in the field. What are mandrakes? Rav Yavruḥei of Levi said: Siglei of Rabbi Yonatan said: Sibiskei.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֲלֶכְּסַנְדְּרִי כׇּל הָעוֹסֵק בְּתוֹרָה לִשְׁמָהּ מֵשִׂים שָׁלוֹם בְּפָמַלְיָא שֶׁל מַעְלָה וּבְפָמַלְיָא שֶׁל מַטָּה שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר אוֹ יַחֲזֵק בְּמָעֻזִּי יַעֲשֶׂה שָׁלוֹם לִי שָׁלוֹם יַעֲשֶׂה לִּי
human_translation: Rabbi Alexandri says: Anyone who engages in Torah for its own sake introduces peace into the entourage above and into the entourage below, as it is stated: “Or let him take hold of My stronghold [ ma’uzi ], that he may make peace with Me; and he shall make peace with Me”
llm_translation: Rabbi Alexandri said: Anyone who engages in Torah study for its own sake, peace is placed in the upper realm and peace is placed in the lower realm, as it is stated: "Or let him take hold of My strength, that he may make peace with Me, peace he shall make with Me."

hebrew_text: רַב אָמַר כְּאִילּוּ בָּנָה פַּלְטֵרִין שֶׁל מַעְלָה וְשֶׁל מַטָּה שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וָאָשִׂים דְּבָרַי בְּפִיךָ וּבְצֵל יָדִי כִּסִּיתִיךָ לִנְטֹעַ שָׁמַיִם וְלִיסֹד אָרֶץ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר אַף מֵגֵין עַל כׇּל הָעוֹלָם כּוּלּוֹ שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וּבְצֵל יָדִי כִּסִּיתִיךָ וְלֵוִי אָמַר אַף מְקָרֵב אֶת הַגְּאוּלָּה שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וְלֵאמֹר לְצִיּוֹן עַמִּי אָתָּה
human_translation: Rav says: as though he built a palace of above and of below, as it is stated: “And I have placed My words in your mouth, and I have covered you in the shadow of My hand, to plant the heavens and lay the foundations of the earth, Rabbi Yoḥanan says: also protects the entire world, as it is stated: “And I have covered you in the shadow of My hand.” And Levi says: He also advances the redemption, as it is stated: “And say to Zion, you are My people.”
llm_translation: Rav said: As if he built chambers above and below, as it is stated, "And I have put My words in your mouth, and with the shadow of My hand have I covered you, to plant the heavens and to lay the foundations of the earth." Rabbi Yochanan said: He also defends the entire world, as it is stated, "And with the shadow of My hand have I covered you." Levi said: He also brings near the redemption, as it is stated, "And to say to Zion, 'You are My people.'"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ כׇּל הַמְלַמֵּד אֶת בֶּן חֲבֵירוֹ תּוֹרָה מַעֲלֶה עָלָיו הַכָּתוּב כְּאִילּוּ עֲשָׂאוֹ שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וְאֵת הַנֶּפֶשׁ אֲשֶׁר עָשׂוּ בְחָרָן רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר כְּאִילּוּ עֲשָׂאָן לְדִבְרֵי תוֹרָה שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וּשְׁמַרְתֶּם אֶת דִּבְרֵי הַבְּרִית הַזֹּאת וַעֲשִׂיתֶם אֹתָם רָבָא אָמַר כְּאִילּוּ עֲשָׂאוֹ לְעַצְמוֹ שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וַעֲשִׂיתֶם אֹתָם אַל תִּקְרֵי אֹתָם אֶלָּא אַתֶּם
human_translation: Reish Lakish said: anyone who teaches Torah to the son of another, the verse ascribes him as though he formed as it is stated: and the souls that they formed in Haran” Rabbi Elazar says: as though he fashioned [ asa’an ] the words of Torah as it is stated: “Observe the words of this covenant, va’asitem otam ” Rava says: as though he fashioned himself, as it is stated: “ Va’asitem otam .” Do not read otam ” rather, atem ,
llm_translation: Reish Lakish said: Anyone who teaches his fellow's son Torah, the Scripture considers it as if he had made him, as it is said, "And the souls that they had made in Haran." Rabbi Elazar says: It is as if he had made them according to the words of Torah, as it is said, "And you shall observe the words of this covenant and perform them." Rava said: It is as if he had made it for himself, as it is said, "And you shall perform them." Do not read it as "them," but rather "you."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ כׇּל הַמְעַשֶּׂה אֶת חֲבֵירוֹ לִדְבַר מִצְוָה מַעֲלֶה עָלָיו הַכָּתוּב כְּאִילּוּ עֲשָׂאָהּ שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וּמַטְּךָ אֲשֶׁר הִכִּיתָ בּוֹ אֶת הַיְאֹר וְכִי מֹשֶׁה הִכָּהוּ וַהֲלֹא אַהֲרֹן הִכָּהוּ אֶלָּא לוֹמַר לָךְ כׇּל הַמְעַשֶּׂה אֶת חֲבֵירוֹ לִדְבַר מִצְוָה מַעֲלֶה עָלָיו הַכָּתוּב כְּאִילּוּ עֲשָׂאָהּ
human_translation: Rabbi Abbahu says: anyone who causes another to a matter of a mitzva, the verse ascribes him as though he performed it as it is stated: and your rod, with which you struck the river, And Moses struck But isn’t Aaron struck Rather, to say to you: Anyone who causes another to a matter of a mitzva, the verse ascribes him as though he performed it
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Avahu: Anyone who involves his fellow in a matter of mitzvah, the Scripture credits him as if he had performed it himself, as it is stated, "And the staff that you struck the river with." Did Moses strike it? Was it not Aaron who struck it? Rather, this is to tell you: Anyone who involves his fellow in a matter of mitzvah, the Scripture credits him as if he had performed it himself.

hebrew_text: אֶפִּיקוֹרוֹס רַב וְרַבִּי חֲנִינָא אָמְרִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ זֶה הַמְבַזֶּה תַּלְמִיד חָכָם רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי אָמְרִי זֶה הַמְבַזֶּה חֲבֵירוֹ בִּפְנֵי תַּלְמִיד חָכָם
human_translation: an epikoros . Rav and Rabbi Ḥanina both say: This one who treats a Torah scholar with contempt. Rabbi Yoḥanan and Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi say: This one who treats another with contempt before a Torah scholar.
llm_translation: Apikoros Rav and Rabbi Chanina both said: This is one who disgraces a Torah scholar. Rabbi Yochanan and Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi both said: This is one who disgraces his fellow in the presence of a Torah scholar.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר הַמְבַזֶּה חֲבֵירוֹ בִּפְנֵי תַּלְמִיד חָכָם אֶפִּיקוֹרוֹס הָוֵי מְבַזֶּה תַּלְמִיד חָכָם עַצְמוֹ  מְגַלֶּה פָּנִים בַּתּוֹרָה שֶׁלֹּא כַּהֲלָכָה הָוֵי אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר מְבַזֶּה תַּלְמִיד חָכָם עַצְמוֹ אֶפִּיקוֹרוֹס הָוֵי מְגַלֶּה פָּנִים בַּתּוֹרָה כְּגוֹן מַאי כְּגוֹן מְנַשֶּׁה בֶּן חִזְקִיָּה
human_translation: Granted, according to the one who says one who treats another with contempt before a Torah scholar is epikoros one who treats a Torah scholar with contempt is who interprets the Torah inappropriately, But according to the one who says one who treats a Torah scholar himself with contempt is epikoros who interprets the Torah inappropriately? Like what like Manasseh, son of Hezekiah,
llm_translation: In truth, according to the one who says that one who degrades his fellow in the presence of a Torah scholar is considered a heretic, he degrades the Torah scholar himself. He reveals the face of the Torah not in accordance with the halacha. Rather, according to the one who says that one who degrades a Torah scholar himself is considered a heretic, he reveals the face of the Torah, such as Menashe son of Hezekiah.

hebrew_text: וְאִיכָּא דְּמַתְנֵי לַהּ אַסֵּיפָא מְגַלֶּה פָּנִים בַּתּוֹרָה רַב וְרַבִּי חֲנִינָא אָמְרִי זֶה הַמְבַזֶּה תַּלְמִיד חָכָם רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי אָמְרִי זֶה הַמְבַזֶּה אֶת חֲבֵירוֹ בִּפְנֵי תַּלְמִיד חָכָם
human_translation: And there are those who teach with regard to the latter clause One who interprets the Torah Rav and Rabbi Ḥanina say: This one who treats a Torah scholar with contempt. Rabbi Yoḥanan and Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi say: This one who treats another with contempt before a Torah scholar.
llm_translation: And there is one who teaches about it: in the latter part, he reveals the face in the Torah. Rav and Rabbi Chanina said: This is one who disgraces a Torah scholar. Rabbi Yochanan and Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: This is one who disgraces his fellow in the presence of a Torah scholar.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר הַמְבַזֶּה תַּלְמִיד חָכָם עַצְמוֹ מְגַלֶּה פָּנִים בַּתּוֹרָה הָוֵי מְבַזֶּה חֲבֵירוֹ בִּפְנֵי תַּלְמִיד חָכָם  אֶפִּיקוֹרוֹס הָוֵי אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר מְבַזֶּה חֲבֵירוֹ בִּפְנֵי תַּלְמִיד חָכָם מְגַלֶּה פָּנִים בַּתּוֹרָה הָוֵי אֶפִּיקוֹרוֹס כְּגוֹן מַאן אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף כְּגוֹן הָנֵי דְּאָמְרִי מַאי אַהֲנוֹ לַן רַבָּנַן לְדִידְהוּ קָרוּ לְדִידְהוּ תָּנוּ
human_translation: Granted, according to the one who says one who treats a Torah scholar himself with contempt is interprets the Torah one who treats another with contempt before a Torah scholar is epikoros But according to the one who says one who treats another with contempt before a Torah scholar is interprets the Torah epikoros Like whom Rav Yosef says: like those who say: what have the Sages benefited us They read for their they study for their
llm_translation: In truth, according to the one who says that one who degrades a Torah scholar himself reveals his face in the Torah, he degrades his colleague in the presence of a Torah scholar. He is considered a heretic. But according to the one who says that one who degrades his colleague in the presence of a Torah scholar reveals his face in the Torah, he is considered a heretic. For example, one who says, "Rav Yosef is like those who say, 'What benefit do the Rabbis bring to us? They only teach for their own benefit.'"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי הַאי מְגַלֶּה פָּנִים בַּתּוֹרָה נָמֵי הוּא דִּכְתִיב אִם לֹא בְרִיתִי יוֹמָם וָלָיְלָה חֻקּוֹת שָׁמַיִם וָאָרֶץ לֹא שָׂמְתִּי אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק מֵהָכָא נָמֵי שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וְנָשָׂאתִי לְכׇל הַמָּקוֹם בַּעֲבוּרָם
human_translation: Abaye said to him: That also who interprets the Torah as it is written: “If not for My covenant, I would not have appointed day and night, the laws of heaven and earth” Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak says: From here too conclude from it, as it is stated: then I will spare the entire place for their sakes”
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: This one who reveals faces in the Torah, it is also written: "If not for My covenant day and night, the laws of heaven and earth I would not have established." Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: Learn from here that He bears all in order for them.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא  כְּגוֹן דְּיָתֵיב קַמֵּיהּ רַבֵּיהּ וְנָפְלָה לֵיהּ שְׁמַעְתָּא בְּדוּכְתָּא אַחֲרִיתִי וְאָמַר הָכִי אָמְרִינַן הָתָם וְלָא אָמַר הָכִי אָמַר מָר  רָבָא אָמַר כְּגוֹן הָנֵי דְּבֵי בִּנְיָמִין אָסְיָא דְּאָמְרִי מַאי אַהֲנוֹ לַן רַבָּנַן מֵעוֹלָם
human_translation: Rather, like one who sits before his teacher and a halakha from another place happens to fall and says: This is what we say there, and he does not say This is what the Master said, Rava said: like those from the house of Binyamin the doctor, who say: what have the Sages benefited us Never
llm_translation: Rather, for example, that he was sitting before his teacher and a report fell to him in the last row, and he said thus we say there, and not thus we say here, Mar Rava said, for example, those of the house of Benjamin, Asya, who said, "What benefit do the Rabbis bring us?"

hebrew_text: לָא שְׁרוֹ לַן עוֹרְבָא וְלָא אֲסַרוּ לַן יוֹנָה
human_translation: have they permitted a raven for us nor have they prohibited a dove for us.
llm_translation: They did not permit us the raven, and they did not prohibit us the dove.

hebrew_text: רָבָא כִּי הֲווֹ מַיְיתִי טְרֵיפְתָּא דְּבֵי בִנְיָמִין קַמֵּיהּ כִּי הֲוָה חָזֵי בַּהּ טַעְמָא לְהֶיתֵּירָא אֲמַר לְהוּ תֶּחֱזוֹ דְּקָא שָׁרֵינָא לְכוּ עוֹרְבָא כִּי הֲוָה חָזֵי לַהּ טַעְמָא לְאִיסּוּרָא אֲמַר לְהוּ תֶּחֱזוֹ דְּקָא אָסַרְנָא לְכוּ יוֹנָה
human_translation: Rava: When they would bring tereifa from the house of Binyamin before him, when he would see in it a reason to permit say to them: See that I am permitting a raven for you, When he would see in it a reason to prohibit say to them: See that I am prohibiting a dove for you.
llm_translation: Rava, when they brought before him a treifa from the house of Benjamin, he stood before it. When he saw in it a reason to permit it, he said to them, "Come, see that the raven is kosher." When he saw in it a reason to prohibit it, he said to them, "Come, see that the dove is treif."

hebrew_text: רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר כְּגוֹן דְּאָמַר הָנֵי רַבָּנַן רַב פָּפָּא אִישְׁתְּלִי וְאָמַר כְּגוֹן הָנֵי רַבָּנַן וְאִיתִּיב בְּתַעֲנִיתָא
human_translation: Rav Pappa says: like one who says: Those Sages, Rav Pappa forgot and said: Like those Sages, and he observed a fast
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: For example, that which those Rabbis said. Rav Papa deliberated and said: For example, those Rabbis, and he raised an objection in a fast.

hebrew_text: לֵוִי בַּר שְׁמוּאֵל וְרַב הוּנָא בַּר חִיָּיא הֲווֹ קָא מְתַקְּנִי מִטְפְּחוֹת סִפְרֵי דְּבֵי רַב יְהוּדָה כִּי מָטוּ מְגִילַּת אֶסְתֵּר אָמְרִי הָא [מְגִילַּת אֶסְתֵּר] לָא בָּעֵי מִטְפַּחַת אֲמַר לְהוּ כִּי הַאי גַוְונָא נָמֵי מִיחְזֵי כִּי אַפְקֵירוּתָא
human_translation: Levi bar Shmuel and Rav Huna bar Ḥiyya were mending mantles for scrolls of the school of Rav Yehuda. When they reached the scroll of Esther they said: This scroll of Esther does not require a mantle, said to them: of that sort also seems like irreverence
llm_translation: Levi son of Samuel and Rav Huna son of Hiyya were fixing the covers of the books of the house of Rav Yehuda. When they reached the Scroll of Esther, they said: "This Scroll of Esther does not require a cover." They said to them: "For this type is recognizable, as it is distinct."

hebrew_text: רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר זֶה הַקּוֹרֵא רַבּוֹ בִּשְׁמוֹ דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִפְּנֵי מָה נֶעֱנַשׁ גֵּיחֲזִי  מִפְּנֵי שֶׁקָּרָא לְרַבּוֹ בִּשְׁמוֹ שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וַיֹּאמֶר גֵּחֲזִי אֲדֹנִי הַמֶּלֶךְ זֹאת הָאִשָּׁה וְזֶה בְּנָהּ אֲשֶׁר הֶחֱיָה אֱלִישָׁע
human_translation: Rav Naḥman says: is one who calls his teacher by his name as Rabbi Yoḥanan said: For what was Gehazi punished? due to that he called his teacher by his name, as it is stated: “And Gehazi said: My lord the king, this is the woman, and this is her son, whom Elisha revived”
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said: This is the one who reads his teacher's name in his own name, as Rabbi Yochanan said: Why was Gehazi punished? Because he called his teacher by his name, as it is said, "And Gehazi said, 'My lord the king, this is the woman and this is her son whom Elisha revived.'"

hebrew_text: יָתֵיב רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי זֵירָא וְיָתֵיב וְקָאָמַר עָתִיד הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לְהוֹצִיא נַחַל מִבֵּית קׇדְשֵׁי הַקֳּדָשִׁים וְעָלָיו כׇּל מִינֵי מְגָדִים שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וְעַל הַנַּחַל יַעֲלֶה עַל שְׂפָתוֹ מִזֶּה וּמִזֶּה כׇּל עֵץ מַאֲכָל לֹא יִבּוֹל עָלֵהוּ וְלֹא יִתֹּם פִּרְיוֹ לׇחֳדָשָׁיו יְבַכֵּר כִּי מֵימָיו מִן הַמִּקְדָּשׁ [הֵמָּה] יוֹצְאִים וְהָיָה פִרְיוֹ לְמַאֲכָל וְעָלֵהוּ לִתְרוּפָה  אֲמַר לֵיהּ הָהוּא סָבָא יִישַׁר וְכֵן אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן יִישַׁר אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה לְרַבִּי זֵירָא כִּי הַאי גַּוְנָא מִיחְזֵי אַפְקֵרוּתָא
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya sat before Rabbi Zeira, and sat and said: The Holy One, Blessed be He, will cause a river to emerge from the Holy of Holies, and alongside it all sorts of delicacies as it is stated: “And the river upon its bank, on this side and on that side shall grow every tree for food, whose leaf shall not wither, neither shall its fruit fall; it shall bring forth new fruit every month, because their waters emerged from the Sanctuary; and its fruit shall be for food and its leaf for medicine” A certain elder said to Well done, and so Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Well done. Rabbi Yirmeya said to Rabbi Zeira: of that sort, seem like irreverence
llm_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya sat before Rabbi Zeira and he sat and said: The Holy One, blessed be He, is destined to bring forth a river from the Holy of Holies, and upon it will grow all kinds of delicacies, as it is stated, "And by the river, upon its bank, on this side and on that side, shall grow every tree for food, whose leaf shall not wither, neither shall its fruit fail; it shall bring forth new fruit every month, because its waters issue out of the sanctuary; they shall be for food, and its fruit shall be for healing." He said to him, that elder: "You have spoken well." And so said Rabbi Yochanan: "You have spoken well." Rabbi Yirmeya said to Rabbi Zeira: "For this garden, do you see any redemption?"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ הָא [הַאי] סַיּוֹעֵי קָא מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ [לָךְ] אֶלָּא אִי שְׁמִיעַ לָךְ הָא שְׁמִיעַ לָךְ כִּי הָא דְּיָתֵיב רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן וְקָא דָרֵישׁ עָתִיד הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לְהָבִיא אֲבָנִים טוֹבוֹת וּמַרְגָּלִיּוֹת שֶׁהֵן שְׁלֹשִׁים עַל שְׁלֹשִׁים אַמּוֹת וְחוֹקֵק בָּהֶם עֶשֶׂר בְּרוּם עֶשְׂרִים וּמַעֲמִידָן בְּשַׁעֲרֵי יְרוּשָׁלַיִם שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וְשַׂמְתִּי כַּדְכֹד שִׁמְשֹׁתַיִךְ וּשְׁעָרַיִךְ לְאַבְנֵי אֶקְדָּח וְגוֹ' לִגְלֵג עָלָיו אוֹתוֹ תַּלְמִיד אָמַר הַשְׁתָּא כְּבֵיעֲתָא דְצִילְצְלָא לָא מַשְׁכְּחִינַן  כּוּלֵּי הַאי מַשְׁכְּחִינַן
human_translation: said to him: But isn’t he supporting your Rather, if you heard this you heard: like that which Rabbi Yoḥanan sat and taught: The Holy One, Blessed be He, is destined to bring precious stones and jewels that are thirty by thirty cubits, and He will bore in them ten by twenty in height and place them as the gates of Jerusalem, as it is stated: “And I will make your pinnacles of rubies and your gates of carbuncles” A certain student mocked him said: Now, we do not find comparable the egg of a palm dove. we find as large as that
llm_translation: He said to him, "This support is supporting you, but if you do not hear this, hear this: as Rabbi Yochanan was sitting and expounding, the Holy One, blessed be He, is destined to bring good stones and sapphires, each thirty by thirty cubits, and engrave on them ten cubits high and establish them in the gates of Jerusalem, as it is said, 'And I will make your battlements of rubies, and your gates of carbuncles, and so on.' That disciple said, 'Now, like the flicker of a lizard, we do not forget, we remember all this.'"

hebrew_text: לְיָמִים הִפְלִיגָה סְפִינָתוֹ בַּיָּם חֲזִינְהוּ לְמַלְאֲכֵי הַשָּׁרֵת דְּקָא מְנַסְּרִי אֲבָנִים טוֹבוֹת וּמַרְגָּלִיּוֹת אֲמַר לְהוּ הָנֵי לְמַאן אָמְרִי עָתִיד הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לְהַעֲמִידָן בְּשַׁעֲרֵי יְרוּשָׁלַיִם כִּי הֲדַר אַשְׁכְּחֵיהּ לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן דְּיָתֵיב וְקָא דָרֵישׁ אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי דְּרוֹשׁ וּלְךָ נָאֶה לִדְרוֹשׁ כְּשֵׁם שֶׁאָמַרְתָּ כָּךְ רָאִיתִי אָמַר לוֹ רֵיקָה אִם לֹא רָאִיתָ לֹא הֶאֱמַנְתָּ מְלַגְלֵג עַל דִּבְרֵי חֲכָמִים אַתָּה יְהַב בֵּיהּ עֵינֵיהּ וַעֲשָׂאוֹ גַּל שֶׁל עֲצָמוֹת
human_translation: Sometime ship set sail at sea. He saw the ministering angels cutting precious stones He said to For whom these said The Holy One, Blessed be He, is destined to place them at the gates of Jerusalem. When returned, he found Rabbi Yoḥanan, who was sitting and teaching. said to him: My teacher, teach, and it is fitting for you to teach. Just as you said so I saw. said to him: Good-for-nothing, if you did not see you would not believe You mocks the statements of the Sages. directed his eyes toward him and rendered him a pile of bones.
llm_translation: For days his ship sailed on the sea, he saw the ministering angels who were removing good stones and pearls. He said to them, "For whom are these?" They said to him, "The Holy One, blessed be He, will set them in the gates of Jerusalem, for the beauty of Rabbi Yochanan, who was sitting and expounding. He said to him, "Rabbi, expound." He said to him, "It is fitting for you to expound, as you have said." "So have I seen," he said to him. "Empty one! If you did not see, you would not believe. You scoff at the words of the sages." He gave him his eyes, and he made him a heap of bones.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי 'וָאוֹלֵךְ אֶתְכֶם קוֹמְמִיּוּת' רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר מָאתַיִם אַמָּה כִּשְׁתֵּי קוֹמוֹת שֶׁל אָדָם הָרִאשׁוֹן רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר מֵאָה אַמָּה כְּנֶגֶד הֵיכָל וּכְותָלָיו שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר 'אֲשֶׁר בָּנֵינוּ כִּנְטִעִים מְגֻדָּלִים בִּנְעוּרֵיהֶם בְּנוֹתֵינוּ כְזָוִיּוֹת מְחֻטָּבוֹת תַּבְנִית הֵיכָל' וְגוֹ'
human_translation: raises an objection “And I made you go upright [ komemiyyut ]” Rabbi Meir says two hundred cubits the equivalent of twice the height of Adam the first Rabbi Yehuda says: one hundred cubits corresponding to Sanctuary and its walls, as it is stated: “For our sons are as plants grown up in their youth; our daughters as cornerstones, carved in the fashion of a palace”
llm_translation: The question was raised: "And I will walk among you" (Leviticus 26:12). Rabbi Meir says: Two hundred cubits like the two statures of the first man. Rabbi Yehuda says: One hundred cubits corresponding to the Sanctuary and its walls, as it is stated, "Our sons are like saplings, grown up in their youth; our daughters like corner pillars, carved in palace style" (Psalms 144:12).

hebrew_text: כִּי קָאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן  לְכַוֵּי דְּבֵי זִיקָא
human_translation: When Rabbi Yoḥanan says to the windows wind enters.
llm_translation: When Rabbi Yochanan said "to establish the house of Zikai"

hebrew_text: מַאי וְעָלֵהוּ לִתְרוּפָה רַבִּי יִצְחָק בַּר אֲבוּדִימִי וְרַב חִסְדָּא חַד אָמַר  לְהַתִּיר פֶּה שֶׁל מַעְלָה וְחַד אָמַר  לְהַתִּיר פֶּה שֶׁל מַטָּה
human_translation: What And its leaf for medicine [ literufa ]? Rabbi Yitzḥak bar Avudimi and Rav Ḥisda One says: To unlock the mouth [ lehattir peh ] above, And one says: to unlock the mouth below,
llm_translation: What is the meaning of "and offer it as a contribution"? Rabbi Yitzchak bar Avudimi and Rav Hisda, one said to permit the mouth of the upper one, and one said to permit the mouth of the lower one.

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר נָמֵי חִזְקִיָּה אָמַר  לְהַתִּיר פֶּה אִילְּמִין בַּר קַפָּרָא אָמַר לְהַתִּיר פֶּה עֲקָרוֹת רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר לִתְרוּפָה מַמָּשׁ מַאי לִתְרוּפָה רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר  לְתוֹאַר פָּנִים שֶׁל בַּעֲלֵי הַפֶּה
human_translation: It was also stated Ḥizkiyya says To unlock the mouth of mutes, bar Kappara says To unlock the mouth of barren women. Rabbi Yoḥanan says: to actual medicine. what is For medicine [ literufa ]? Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani says: to the countenance [ letoar panim ] of the keepers of the mouth [ peh ],
llm_translation: It was stated: Naḥmani, son of Ḥizkiyya, said to permit the mouth of rams. Bar Kappara said to permit the mouth of barren animals. Rabbi Yoḥanan said for actual healing. What is meant by actual healing? Rabbi Shemu'el, son of Naḥmani, said for the adornment of the faces of those with the mouth.

hebrew_text: דָּרֵשׁ רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בְּרַבִּי סִימוֹן כָּל הַמַּשְׁחִיר פָּנָיו עַל דִּבְרֵי תּוֹרָה בָּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה  הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא מַבְהִיק זִיוָיו לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר מַרְאֵהוּ כַּלְּבָנוֹן בָּחוּר כָּאֲרָזִים
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda, son of Rabbi Simon, taught: anyone who blackens his face over matters of Torah in this world, the Holy One, Blessed be He, shines his brightness in the World-to-Come, as it is stated: “His countenance is like Lebanon, excellent as the cedars”
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda, son of Rabbi Simon, expounded: Anyone who blackens his face over matters of Torah in this world, the Holy One, blessed be He, will make his countenance shine in the world to come, as it is stated, "His appearance is like Lebanon, choice as the cedars."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי תַּנְחוּם בְּרַבִּי חֲנִילַאי כׇּל הַמַּרְעִיב עַצְמוֹ עַל דִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה בָּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה  הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא מַשְׂבִּיעוֹ לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר יִרְוְיֻן מִדֶּשֶׁן בֵּיתֶךָ וְנַחַל עֲדָנֶיךָ תַשְׁקֵם
human_translation: Rabbi Tanḥum, son of Rabbi Ḥanilai, says: anyone who starves himself over matters of Torah in this world, the Holy One, Blessed be He, satisfies him in the World-to-Come, as it is stated: “They are abundantly satisfied with the plenty of Your house, and You feed them drink of the river of Your pleasures”
llm_translation: Rabbi Tanhum son of Rabbi Hanilai said: Anyone who starves himself for the words of Torah in this world, the Holy One, blessed be He, will satisfy him in the world to come, as it is said, "You shall be satisfied from the fat of your house, and from the stream of your delights you shall drink."

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא רַב דִּימִי אָמַר עָתִיד הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לִיתֵּן לְכׇל צַדִּיק וְצַדִּיק מְלֹא עוֹמְסוֹ שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר בָּרוּךְ ה' יוֹם יוֹם יַעֲמָס לָנוּ הָאֵל יְשׁוּעָתֵנוּ סֶלָה  אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי וְכִי אֶפְשָׁר לוֹמַר כֵּן וַהֲלֹא כְּבָר נֶאֱמַר מִי מָדַד בְּשׇׁעֳלוֹ מַיִם וְשָׁמַיִם בַּזֶּרֶת תִּכֵּן
human_translation: When Rav Dimi came he said: The Holy One, Blessed be He, will give each and every righteous person His handful, as it is stated: “Blessed be the Lord, Who day by day bears our burden; God is our salvation, Selah” Abaye said to him: And is it possible to say so, But wasn’t it already stated: “Who has measured the waters in the hollow of His hand, and meted out heaven with the span,
llm_translation: When Rav Dimi came, he said: "The Holy One, blessed be He, is destined to give to every righteous person his full load, as it is stated: 'Blessed be the Lord day by day; He bears our burden, the God of our salvation, Selah.' Abaye said to him: Is it possible to say so? Has it not already been said: 'Who has measured the waters in the hollow of His hand, and marked off the heavens with a span?'"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר מַאי טַעְמָא לָא שְׁכִיחַתְּ בְּאַגַּדְתָּא דְּאָמְרִי בְּמַעְרְבָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרָבָא בַּר מָרִי עָתִיד הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לִיתֵּן לְכׇל צַדִּיק וְצַדִּיק שְׁלֹשׁ מֵאוֹת וַעֲשָׂרָה עוֹלָמוֹת שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר לְהַנְחִיל אֹהֲבַי יֵשׁ וְאֹצְרֹתֵיהֶם אֲמַלֵּא יֵשׁ בְּגִימַטְרִיָּא תְּלָת מְאָה וְעַשְׂרָה הָוֵי
human_translation: said: What is the reason you are not familiar with aggada ? As they say in the West, in the name of Rava bar Mari: The Holy One, Blessed be He, will give every righteous person 310 worlds as it is stated: “To bequeath to those who love Me substance [ yesh ]; and I will fill their treasuries” In numerical value, yesh , is 310,
llm_translation: He said, what is the reason? It is not common in the Aggadah that they say in the West, from the name of Rava bar Mari: The Holy One, blessed be He, is destined to give to every righteous person three hundred and ten worlds, as it is stated, "To cause those who love Me to inherit substance, and I will fill their treasuries" (Proverbs 8:21). In gematria, it amounts to three hundred and ten.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר בְּמִדָּה שֶׁאָדָם מוֹדֵד מוֹדְדִין לוֹ דִּכְתִיב 'בְּסַאסְּאָה בְּשַׁלְּחָהּ תְּרִיבֶנָּה'
human_translation: it is taught Rabbi Meir says: In accordance with the measure that a person metes metes for him, as it is written: “In full measure [ besasse’a ] when You send her away do You contend with her”
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi Meir says, "With the measure that a person measures, they measure for him," as it is written, 'In a full measure, pressed down, shaken together, and running over.'

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ וְכִי אֶפְשָׁר לוֹמַר כֵּן אָדָם נוֹתֵן מְלֹא עוֹמְסוֹ לְעָנִי בָּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא נוֹתֵן לוֹ מְלֹא עוֹמְסוֹ לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא וְהָכְתִיב 'שָׁמַיִם בַּזֶּרֶת תִּכֵּן' וְאַתָּה אִי אוֹמֵר כֵּן אֵיזוֹ הִיא מִדָּה מְרוּבָּה (מִדַּת) [מִדָּה] טוֹבָה מְרוּבָּה אוֹ מִדַּת פּוּרְעָנוּת
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua said And is it possible to say that a person gives his handful to a pauper in this world, the Holy One, Blessed be He, gives him His handful in the World-to-Come? But isn’t it written: “And meted out heaven with the span” And you do not say so? Which attributes is greater? the attribute of reward greater or the attribute of punishment
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yehoshua: Is it possible to say so? A person gives his full load to a poor person in this world, the Holy One, blessed be He, gives him his full load in the world to come. And it is written, "He establishes the heavens by His discretion." And do you not say so? Which is the greater measure, a measure of goodness or a measure of punishment?

hebrew_text: הֱוֵי אוֹמֵר מִדָּה טוֹבָה מְרוּבָּה מִמִּדַּת פּוּרְעָנוּת  בְּמִדָּה טוֹבָה כְּתִיב 'וַיְצַו שְׁחָקִים מִמָּעַל וְדַלְתֵי שָׁמַיִם פָּתָח וַיַּמְטֵר עֲלֵיהֶם מָן לֶאֱכֹל' וּבְמִידַּת פּוּרְעָנוּת הוּא אוֹמֵר 'וַאֲרֻבֹּת הַשָּׁמַיִם נִפְתָּחוּ'
human_translation: You must say that the attribute of reward is greater than the attribute of punishment, with regard to the attribute of reward it is written: “He commanded the clouds from above, and opened the doors of heaven, and rained upon them manna to eat” And with regard to the attribute of punishment says: “And the windows of the heavens were opened”
llm_translation: Be it said: A good measure from the measure of abundance, in a good measure it is written, "He commanded the skies above and opened the doors of heaven; He rained down manna upon them to eat." And in the measure of punishment, it says, "The windows of heaven were opened."

hebrew_text: בְּמִידַּת פּוּרְעָנוּת כְּתִיב 'וְיָצְאוּ וְרָאוּ בְּפִגְרֵי הָאֲנָשִׁים הַפֹּשְׁעִים בִּי כִּי תוֹלַעְתָּם לֹא תָמוּת וְאִשָּׁם לֹא תִכְבֶּה וְהָיוּ דֵרָאוֹן לְכׇל בָּשָׂר' וַהֲלֹא אָדָם מוֹשִׁיט אֶצְבָּעוֹ בָּאוּר בָּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה  מִיָּד נִכְוֶה אֶלָּא כְּשֵׁם שֶׁנּוֹתֵן הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא כֹּחַ בָּרְשָׁעִים לְקַבֵּל פּוּרְעָנוּתָם כָּךְ נוֹתֵן הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא כֹּחַ בַּצַּדִּיקִים לְקַבֵּל טוֹבָתָן
human_translation: With regard to the attribute of punishment it is written: “And they shall go forth, and look upon the carcasses of the men who have rebelled against Me; for their worm shall not die, neither shall their fire be quenched; and they shall be an abhorrence to all flesh” Is it not so a person extends his finger into the fire in this world, he is immediately burned? Rather, just as the Holy One, Blessed be He, provides strength to the wicked to receive their punishment, so too, the Holy One, Blessed be He, provides strength to the righteous to receive their reward,
llm_translation: In the measure of retribution it is written, "And they shall go out and see the corpses of the men who have rebelled against Me, for their worm shall not die, and their fire shall not be extinguished, and they shall be a horror to all flesh." But is it not the case that a person points his finger at the light in this world, and immediately he is punished? Rather, just as the Holy One, blessed be He, gives strength to the wicked to receive their retribution, so too the Holy One, blessed be He, gives strength to the righteous to receive their reward.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר אַף הַקּוֹרֵא בַּסְּפָרִים הַחִיצוֹנִים וְכוּ' תָּנָא בְּסִפְרֵי מִינִים רַב יוֹסֵף אָמַר בְּסֵפֶר בֶּן סִירָא נָמֵי אָסוּר לְמִיקְרֵי אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי מַאי טַעְמָא אִילֵּימָא מִשּׁוּם דִּכְתִב [בֵּיהּ] לָא תִּינְטוֹשׁ גִּילְדָּנָא מֵאוּדְנֵיהּ דְּלָא לֵיזִיל מַשְׁכֵיהּ לַחֲבָלָא אֶלָּא צְלִי יָתֵיהּ בְּנוּרָא וְאֵיכוֹל בֵּיהּ תַּרְתֵּין גְּרִיצִים
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: Also one who reads external literature taught books of heretics. Rav Yosef says: It is also prohibited to read the book of ben Sira, Abaye said to What is the reason If we say due to that wrote in it: Do not flay the skin of the fish from its ear, so that its skin does not go to ruin, but roast it on the fire and eat with it two loaves of bread,
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: Even one who reads in the outer books, etc. It was taught in the books of the heretics: Rav Yosef said: In the book of Ben Sira, it is prohibited to read. Abaye said to him: What is the reason? If you say because it is written in it, "Do not abandon your friend or your father's friend," so that he does not go to the rope, but roast it in the fire and eat it with two carobs.

hebrew_text: אִי מִפְּשָׁטֵיהּ  בְּאוֹרָיְיתָא נָמֵי כְּתִב לֹא תַשְׁחִית אֶת עֵצָהּ אִי מִדְּרָשָׁא  אוֹרַח אַרְעָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דְּלָא לִיבְעוֹל שֶׁלֹּא כְּדַרְכָּהּ
human_translation: If from its literal in the Torah, also wrote: “You shall not destroy its trees” If from homiletic interpretation is teaching us proper conduct: should not engage in sexual intercourse in an atypical manner,
llm_translation: If from its simple meaning in the Torah, it is said "do not destroy its tree," if from the interpretation, the way of the land teaches us that it should not be uprooted in a way that is not its normal manner.

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא מִשּׁוּם דִּכְתִיב בַּת לְאָבִיהָ מַטְמוֹנֶת שָׁוְא מִפַּחְדָּהּ לֹא יִישַׁן בַּלַּיְלָה בְּקַטְנוּתָהּ  שֶׁמָּא תִּתְפַּתֶּה בְּנַעֲרוּתָהּ  שֶׁמָּא תִּזְנֶה בָּגְרָה  שֶׁמָּא לֹא תִּינָּשֵׂא נִישֵּׂאת  שֶׁמָּא לֹא יִהְיוּ לָהּ בָּנִים הִזְקִינָה  שֶׁמָּא תַּעֲשֶׂה כְּשָׁפִים הָא רַבָּנַן נָמֵי אַמְרוּהָ אִי אֶפְשָׁר לְעוֹלָם בְּלֹא זְכָרִים וּבְלֹא נְקֵבוֹת אַשְׁרֵי מִי שֶׁבָּנָיו זְכָרִים אוֹי לוֹ לְמִי שֶׁבָּנָיו נְקֵבוֹת
human_translation: Rather, because it is written A daughter is for her father false treasure; due to fear for her he will not sleep at night: During her minority, lest she be seduced; during her young womanhood lest she engage in licentiousness; once she has reached her majority, lest she not marry; once she marries, lest she have no children; once she grows old, lest she engage in witchcraft Didn’t the Sages also say it impossible for the world without males and without females; happy is one whose children are males and woe unto him whose children are females.
llm_translation: And rather, because it is written, "The daughter of her father, she is obligated to be silent in her fear, she shall not sleep at night in her youth, lest she be seduced in her adolescence, lest she commit harlotry in her maturity, lest she not be taken in marriage, lest she not have children when she grows old, lest she practice witchcraft." The Rabbis also said: It is impossible for the world to exist without males and females. Fortunate is one whose children are males, woe to one whose children are females.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מִשּׁוּם דִּכְתִיב לָא תַּעֵיל דְּוָיָא בְּלִבָּךְ דְּגַבְרֵי גִּיבָּרִין קְטַל דְּוָיָא הָא שְׁלֹמֹה אַמְרַהּ דְּאָגָה בְלֶב אִישׁ יַשְׁחֶנָּה רַבִּי אַמֵּי וְרַבִּי אַסִּי חַד אָמַר יַשִּׂיחֶנָּה מִדַּעְתּוֹ וְחַד אָמַר יְשִׂיחֶנָּה לַאֲחֵרִים
human_translation: Rather, because it is written Do not introduce anxiety into your heart, as anxiety has killed mighty men Didn’t Solomon say it “Anxiety in a man’s heart dejects him [ yashḥena ]” Rabbi Ami and Rabbi Asi One says He shall remove it [ yesiḥenna ] from his mind, And one says: He shall tell it [ yesiḥenna ] to others,
llm_translation: Rather, because it is written, "Do not let deceit be in your heart," when mighty men have spoken deceit, it is as if they have killed deceit. This is what Shlomo said: "Anxiety in a man's heart weighs it down." Rabbi Ammi and Rabbi Assi, one said: he speaks it from his own knowledge, and one said: he speaks it to others.

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא מִשּׁוּם דִּכְתִיב מְנַע רַבִּים מִתּוֹךְ בֵּיתֶךָ וְלֹא הַכֹּל תָּבִיא אֶל בֵּיתֶךָ וְהָא רַבִּי נָמֵי אַמְרַהּ דְּתַנְיָא רַבִּי אוֹמֵר לְעוֹלָם לֹא יַרְבֶּה אָדָם רֵעִים בְּתוֹךְ בֵּיתוֹ שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר 'אִישׁ רֵעִים לְהִתְרוֹעֵעַ'
human_translation: Rather, because it is written Prevent the multitudes from inside your house, and do not bring everyone into your house But didn’t Rabbi also say it, as it is taught Rabbi says: A person should never have many friends inside his house, as it is stated: “There are friends that one has to his own detriment”
llm_translation: And rather, because it is written, "Keep away from the many within your house, and do not bring everyone into your house." But isn't it so? Rabbi Naḥmei also said in the name of a Baraita: Rabbi says, "A person should never have too many friends within his house, as it is stated, 'A man of many friends comes to ruin.'"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מִשּׁוּם דִּכְתִיב זַלְדְּקַן  קוּרְטְמָן עַבְדְּקַן  סִכְסָן דְּנָפַח בְּכָסֵיהּ  לָא צָחֵי אָמַר 'בְּמַאי אֵיכוֹל לַחְמָא'  לַחְמָא סַב מִינֵּיהּ מַאן דְּאִית לֵיהּ מַעְבַּרְתָּא בְּדִיקְנֵיהּ  כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא יָכְלִי לֵיהּ
human_translation: Rather, because it is written A sparse-bearded man is clever; a thick-bearded man is a fool. One who blows on his cup is not thirsty. One who said: With what will I eat bread, take the bread from him. One who has a passage in his beard, the entire world is unable to overcome him.
llm_translation: Instead, because it is written: "Zaldakan, Kurteman, Avdekan, Sikhsan, who blew into his cups, did not succeed," he said, "With what can one eat bread?" The bread is removed from its kind, whoever has a stomachache, with his stomach, the whole world cannot endure it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף מִילֵּי מְעַלַּיְיתָא דְּאִית בֵּיהּ דָּרְשִׁינַן לְהוּ אִשָּׁה טוֹבָה  מַתָּנָה טוֹבָה בְּחֵיק יְרֵא אֱלֹהִים תִּנָּתֵן אִשָּׁה רָעָה  צָרַעַת לְבַעְלָהּ מַאי תַּקַּנְתֵּיהּ  יְגָרְשֶׁנָּה מִבֵּיתוֹ וְיִתְרַפֵּא מִצָּרַעְתּוֹ אִשָּׁה יָפָה  אַשְׁרֵי בַּעְלָהּ מִסְפַּר יָמָיו כִּפְלַיִם
human_translation: Rav Yosef says: we teach the superior matters that are in it A good wife is a good gift; she will be given into the bosom of a God-fearing man A bad wife is leprosy for her husband. What is his remedy? He shall chase her from his house and will be healed from his leprosy A beautiful wife, happy is her husband; the number of his days is doubled
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: Matters of the upper world, in which we expound to them: "A good wife, a good gift in the bosom, a God-fearing woman shall be given." A bad wife, leprosy to her husband. What is the remedy for her? He shall divorce her from his house, and he shall be healed from his leprosy. A beautiful wife, fortunate is her husband, his days shall be doubled.

hebrew_text: הַעְלֵם עֵינֶיךָ מֵאֵשֶׁת חֵן פֶּן תִּלָּכֵד בִּמְצוּדָתָהּ אַל תֵּט אֵצֶל בַּעְלָהּ לִמְסוֹךְ עִמּוֹ יַיִן וְשֵׁכָר כִּי בְּתוֹאַר אִשָּׁה יָפָה רַבִּים הוּשְׁחָתוּ וַעֲצוּמִים כׇּל הֲרוּגֶיהָ רַבִּים הָיוּ פִּצְעֵי רוֹכֵל  הַמַּרְגִּילִים לִדְבַר עֶרְוָה כְּנִיצוֹץ מַבְעִיר גַּחֶלֶת כִּכְלוּב מָלֵא עוֹף כֵּן בָּתֵּיהֶם מְלֵאִים מִרְמָה מְנַע רַבִּים מִתּוֹךְ בֵּיתֶךָ וְלֹא הַכֹּל תָּבִיא בֵּיתֶךָ רַבִּים יִהְיוּ דּוֹרְשֵׁי שְׁלוֹמֶךָ גַּלֵּה סוֹדְךָ לְאֶחָד מֵאָלֶף מִשּׁוֹכֶבֶת חֵיקֶךָ שְׁמוֹר פִּתְחֵי פִיךָ אַל תֵּצַר צָרַת מָחָר כִּי לֹא תֵדַע מַה יֵּלֶד יוֹם שֶׁמָּא לְמָחָר אֵינֶנּוּ וְנִמְצָא מִצְטַעֵר עַל עוֹלָם שֶׁאֵינוֹ שֶׁלּוֹ
human_translation: Avert your eyes from a woman of grace, lest you be trapped in her snare. Turn not to her husband to mix wine and strong drink with him, as many have been corrupted by the beauty of the beautiful woman, and mighty are all her fatalities Many are the wounds of a peddler who accustom to matters of forbidden sexual relations. Like a spark ignites a coal like a cage full of birds, so too, their houses are filled with deceit Prevent the multitudes from inside your house, and do not bring everyone into your house Let many be those who greet you; reveal your secrets to one in a thousand. From she who lies in your bosom guard the openings of your mouth, Grieve not about tomorrow’s trouble, because you know not what a day may bring; perhaps tomorrow you will no longer be, and one will have worried about a world that is not his.
llm_translation: Conceal your eyes from a woman of grace, lest you be ensnared by her. Do not recline with her husband to drink wine and strong drink, for the beauty of a woman has caused many to be corrupted, and mighty men have been slain by her. Many are the wounds of the peddlers who accustom themselves to speak lewdly, like a spark that kindles coals, like a dog that eats birds, so are their houses full of deceit. Keep many away from your house, and do not bring everyone into your house, for many are those who seek your peace. Reveal your secret to one in a thousand, but keep the secret of your bedfellow. Guard the openings of your mouth, do not bring tomorrow's trouble upon yourself, for you do not know what a day may bring forth, perhaps what is born today will not be there tomorrow, and you will find yourself grieving over a world that is not yours.

hebrew_text: כׇּל יְמֵי עָנִי רָעִים בֶּן סִירָא אוֹמֵר אַף לֵילוֹת בִּשְׁפַל גַּגִּים גַּגּוֹ וּבִמְרוֹם הָרִים כַּרְמוֹ מִמְּטַר גַּגִּים לְגַגּוֹ וּמֵעֲפַר כַּרְמוֹ לִכְרָמִים
human_translation: “All the days of the poor are terrible” ben Sira says: Also the nights roof is among the lowest roofs and in the elevation of the hills is his vineyard, From the rain on the roofs to his roof and the soil of his vineyard to vineyards.
llm_translation: All the days of the poor, Ben Sira says, even the nights on the roofs of low roofs, his roof, and on the heights of the mountains, his vineyard from the rain of roofs to his roof, and from the dust of his vineyard to vineyards.

hebrew_text: [סִימָן זֵירָא רָבָא מְשַׁרְשְׁיָא חֲנִינָא טוֹבִיָּה יַנַּאי יָפֶה  יוֹחָנָן מְרַחֵם  יְהוֹשֻׁעַ מְקַצֵּר]
human_translation: a mnemonic Zeira; Rava; Mesharshiyya; Ḥanina toviyya , Yannai yafe , Yoḥanan meraḥem , Yehoshua mekatzer ,
llm_translation: Siman Zeira Raba Mesharshaya Chanina Toviya Yannai Yafeh Yochanan Merachem Yehoshua Mekatzer

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא אָמַר רַב מַאי דִּכְתִיב כׇּל יְמֵי עָנִי רָעִים אֵלּוּ בַּעֲלֵי תַלְמוּד וְטוֹב לֵב מִשְׁתֶּה תָמִיד  אֵלּוּ בַּעֲלֵי מִשְׁנָה
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira says Rav says: What which is written: “All the days of the poor are terrible”; these are masters of the Talmud, “And for the good-hearted it is always a feast”; these are masters of the Mishna,
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira said, Rabbi said: What is the meaning of what is written, "All the days of the poor are evil"? These are the scholars of the Talmud. And "but a feast is continual for the cheerful"? These are the scholars of the Mishnah.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר אִיפְּכָא וְהַיְינוּ דְּאָמַר רַב מְשַׁרְשְׁיָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרָבָא מַאי דִּכְתִיב מַסִּיעַ אֲבָנִים יֵעָצֵב בָּהֶם אֵלּוּ בַּעֲלֵי מִשְׁנָה וּבוֹקֵעַ עֵצִים יִסָּכֶן בָּם  אֵלּוּ בַּעֲלֵי תַלְמוּד
human_translation: Rava says the opposite and this is which Rav Mesharshiyya said in the name of Rava: What which is written: “One who quarries stones shall be saddened by them these are masters of the Mishna, “And he who chops wood shall be warmed by it”; these are masters of the Talmud,
llm_translation: Rava said: The opposite is true. And this is what Rav Mesharshaya said in the name of Rava: What is the meaning of the verse, "He who splits wood is endangered by it, and he who cleaves stones is hurt by them"? - These are the masters of Mishnah, and those who delve into Talmud.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי חֲנִינָא אוֹמֵר כׇּל יְמֵי עָנִי רָעִים זֶה מִי שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ אִשָּׁה רָעָה וְטוֹב לֵב מִשְׁתֶּה תָמִיד זֶה שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ אִשָּׁה טוֹבָה רַבִּי יַנַּאי אוֹמֵר כׇּל יְמֵי עָנִי רָעִים זֶה אִסְטְנִיס וְטוֹב לֵב מִשְׁתֶּה תָמִיד זֶה שֶׁדַּעְתּוֹ יָפָה רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר כׇּל יְמֵי עָנִי רָעִים זֶה רַחְמָנִי וְטוֹב לֵב מִשְׁתֶּה תָמִיד זֶה אַכְזָרִי רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי אָמַר כׇּל יְמֵי עָנִי רָעִים זֶה
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina says: “All the days of the poor are terrible”; this one who has a bad wife. “And for the good-hearted it is always a feast”; this one who has a good wife. Rabbi Yannai says: “All the days of the poor are terrible”; this delicate [ istenis ], “And for the good-hearted it is always a feast”; this broad-minded [ da’ato yafe ], Rabbi Yoḥanan says: “All the days of the poor are terrible”; this compassionate [ meraḥem ], “And for the good-hearted it is always a feast”; this cruel Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi says: “All the days of the poor are terrible”; this
llm_translation: Rabbi Chanina says: "All the days of a poor person are bad - this is someone who has a bad wife, but a good heart, constantly feasting - this is someone who has a good wife." Rabbi Yannai says: "All the days of a poor person are bad - this is someone who is fastidious, but has a good heart, constantly feasting - this is someone whose knowledge is beautiful." Rabbi Yochanan says: "All the days of a poor person are bad - this is someone who is merciful, but has a good heart, constantly feasting - this is someone who is cruel." Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi says: "All the days of a poor person are bad..."

hebrew_text: שֶׁדַּעְתּוֹ קְצָרָה וְטוֹב לֵב מִשְׁתֶּה תָמִיד  זֶה שֶׁדַּעְתּוֹ רְחָבָה וְאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי כׇּל יְמֵי עָנִי רָעִים וְהָאִיכָּא שַׁבָּתוֹת וְיָמִים טוֹבִים כְּדִשְׁמוּאֵל דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל שִׁינּוּי וֶסֶת תְּחִלַּת חוֹלִי מֵעַיִים
human_translation: who is intolerant [ da’ato ketzara ] “And for the good-hearted it is always a feast”; this who is tolerant And Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi says “All the days of the poor are terrible”: But aren’t there Shabbatot and Festivals, in accordance with that of Shmuel, as Shmuel says: A change in routine the onset of an intestinal ailment.
llm_translation: The knowledge his short and good heart feasting always this the knowledge his broad and said Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi all days poor and bad and there are Sabbaths and good days as Shmuel said change and plaster beginning of illness from the intestines.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן הַקּוֹרֵא פָּסוּק שֶׁל שִׁיר הַשִּׁירִים וְעוֹשֶׂה אוֹתוֹ כְּמִין זֶמֶר וְהַקּוֹרֵא פָּסוּק בְּבֵית מִשְׁתָּאוֹת בְּלֹא זְמַנּוֹ  מֵבִיא רָעָה לָעוֹלָם מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהַתּוֹרָה חוֹגֶרֶת שַׂק וְעוֹמֶדֶת לִפְנֵי הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא וְאוֹמֶרֶת לְפָנָיו 'רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם עֲשָׂאוּנִי בָּנֶיךָ כְּכִנּוֹר שֶׁמְּנַגְּנִין בּוֹ לֵצִים'
human_translation: The Sages taught: One who reads a verse from Song of Songs and renders it a form of song, and one who reads verse at a banquet house, not at its time, introduces evil to the world, as the Torah girds sackcloth and stands before the Holy One, Blessed be He, and says before Him: Master of the Universe, Your children have rendered me like a harp on which clowns play.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: One who recites a verse from the Song of Songs and renders it as a song, and one who recites a verse in a banquet hall out of its proper context, brings evil into the world, because the Torah is dressed in sackcloth and stands before the Holy One, blessed be He, saying before Him, "Master of the Universe, Your children have made me like a harp on which jesters play."

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָהּ 'בִּתִּי בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁאוֹכְלִין וְשׁוֹתִין בַּמֶּה יִתְעַסְּקוּ' אָמְרָה לְפָנָיו 'רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם אִם בַּעֲלֵי מִקְרָא הֵן  יַעַסְקוּ בַּתּוֹרָה וּבַנְּבִיאִים וּבַכְּתוּבִים אִם בַּעֲלֵי מִשְׁנָה הֵן  יַעַסְקוּ בַּמִּשְׁנָה בַּהֲלָכוֹת וּבְהַגָּדוֹת וְאִם בַּעֲלֵי תַלְמוּד הֵן  יַעַסְקוּ בְּהִלְכוֹת פֶּסַח בַּפֶּסַח בְּהִלְכוֹת עֲצֶרֶת בָּעֲצֶרֶת בְּהִלְכוֹת חַג בֶּחָג' הֵעִיד רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן חֲנַנְיָא כׇּל הַקּוֹרֵא פָּסוּק בִּזְמַנּוֹ  מֵבִיא טוֹבָה לָעוֹלָם שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר 'וְדָבָר בְּעִתּוֹ מַה טּוֹב'
human_translation: says to My daughter, during the time that they are eating and drinking, in what should they be engaged? says before Him: Master of the Universe, if they are masters of the Bible, let them engage in Torah, Prophets, and Writings. If they are masters of the Mishna, let them engage in the Mishna, in halakha , and in aggada . And if they are masters of the Talmud, let them engage in the halakhot of Passover on Passover, in the halakhot of Shavuot on Shavuot , in the halakhot of Sukkot on Sukkot . Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar testified in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Ḥananya: Anyone who reads a verse at its time introduces good into the world, as it is stated: “And a word in its season, how good is it”
llm_translation: He said to her, "My daughter, at the time when we eat and drink, what should we engage in?" She said to him, "Master of the Universe, if they are scholars of Scripture, let them engage in Torah, Prophets, and Writings. If they are scholars of Mishnah, let them engage in Mishnah, Halakhot, and Aggadot. And if they are scholars of Talmud, let them engage in the laws of Passover on Passover, the laws of Shavuot on Shavuot, and the laws of Sukkot on Sukkot." Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar testified in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Hanania: "Anyone who recites a verse in its proper time brings goodness to the world, as it is said, 'And a word spoken in its time, how good it is.'"

hebrew_text: וְהַלּוֹחֵשׁ עַל הַמַּכָּה וְכוּ' אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן וּבְרוֹקֵק בָּהּ לְפִי שֶׁאֵין מַזְכִּירִין שֵׁם שָׁמַיִם עַל הָרְקִיקָה אִיתְּמַר רַב אָמַר אֲפִילּוּ נֶגַע צָרַעַת רַבִּי חֲנִינָא אָמַר אֲפִילּוּ וַיִּקְרָא אֶל מֹשֶׁה
human_translation: And one who whispers over a wound. Rabbi Yoḥanan says: And where he spits into as one does not mention the name of Heaven over spittle, It was stated Rav says: Even a leprous mark Rabbi Ḥanina says: Even “And He called to Moses”
llm_translation: The one who whispers over the wound, etc. Rabbi Yochanan said, and one spits on it, because they do not mention the name of Heaven over the spittle. It was stated: Rav said, even if it is a nega of tzara'at. Rabbi Chanina said, even if it is "And He called to Moses."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן סָכִין וּמְמַשְׁמְשִׁין בִּבְנֵי מֵעַיִים בְּשַׁבָּת וְלוֹחֲשִׁין לְחִישַׁת נְחָשִׁים וְעַקְרַבִּים בְּשַׁבָּת וּמַעֲבִירִין כְּלִי עַל גַּב הָעַיִן בְּשַׁבָּת אָמַר רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים  בִּכְלִי הַנִּיטָּל אֲבָל בִּכְלִי שֶׁאֵינוֹ נִיטָּל  אָסוּר וְאֵין שׁוֹאֲלִין בִּדְבַר שֵׁדִים בְּשַׁבָּת רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר אַף בַּחוֹל אָסוּר
human_translation: The Sages taught One may smear oil and rub intestinal on Shabbat One may whisper incantations of snakes and scorpions on Shabbat And one may pass vessel upon eye on Shabbat, Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: In what are these matters stated? in a vessel that be moved But a vessel that not be moved, prohibited And one may not consult the words of demons on Shabbat. Rabbi Yosei says: Even during the week prohibited
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: One may carry a knife and use it among the inhabitants of a courtyard on Shabbat, and one may whisper incantations for snakebites and scorpion stings on Shabbat, and one may pass a vessel over the eye on Shabbat. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said: In what case are these matters stated? In a vessel that is removable, but in a vessel that is not removable, it is prohibited. And one may not inquire about demons on Shabbat. Rabbi Yosei says: It is also prohibited on weekdays.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא (אֵין) הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי וְאַף רַבִּי יוֹסֵי לֹא אֲמָרָהּ אֶלָּא מִשּׁוּם סַכָּנָה כִּי הָא דְּרַב יִצְחָק בַּר יוֹסֵף דְּאִיבְּלַע בְּאַרְזָא וְאִתְעֲבִיד לֵיהּ נִיסָּא פְּקַע אַרְזָא וּפַלְטֵיהּ
human_translation: Rav Huna said: halakha in accordance with Rabbi Yosei. And even Rabbi Yosei did not say rather, due to danger, as that concerning Rav Yitzḥak bar Yosef, who was swallowed into a cedar and a miracle was performed for him and the cedar split and expelled him.
llm_translation: Rav Huna said: The halakha does not follow Rabbi Yosei, and even Rabbi Yosei did not say it except due to danger. For this is like the case of Rav Yitzchak bar Yosef who swallowed a cedar and a miracle was performed for him, the cedar split and he was saved.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן סָכִין וּמְמַשְׁמְשִׁין בִּבְנֵי מֵעַיִים בְּשַׁבָּת וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא יַעֲשֶׂה כְּדֶרֶךְ שֶׁהוּא עוֹשֶׂה בַּחוֹל הֵיכִי עָבֵיד רַבִּי חָמָא בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא אָמַר סָךְ וְאַחַר כָּךְ מְמַשְׁמֵשׁ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר סָךְ וּמְמַשְׁמֵשׁ בְּבַת אַחַת
human_translation: The Sages taught One may smear oil and rub intestinal on Shabbat, provided that he does not do in the manner in which he does during the week. How does one do Rabbi Ḥama, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, says: One smears oil and afterward rubs Rabbi Yoḥanan says: One smears oil and rubs simultaneously.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: One may handle a knife on Shabbat in the intestines of an animal, provided that one does not do so in the usual manner as one would on a weekday. How did Rabbi Ḥama son of Rabbi Ḥanina do it? He said: He would slaughter and then handle the knife. Rabbi Yoḥanan said: He would slaughter and handle the knife simultaneously.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן שָׂרֵי שֶׁמֶן וְשָׂרֵי בֵיצִים  מוּתָּרִין לִשְׁאוֹל בָּהֶן אֶלָּא מִפְּנֵי שֶׁמְּכַזְּבִין לוֹחֲשִׁין עַל שֶׁמֶן שֶׁבִּכְלִי וְאֵין לוֹחֲשִׁין עַל שֶׁמֶן שֶׁבַּיָּד לְפִיכָךְ סָכִין מִשֶּׁמֶן שֶׁבַּיָּד וְאֵין סָכִין מִשֶּׁמֶן שֶׁבִּכְלִי
human_translation: The Sages taught demons of oil and demons of eggs, it is permitted to consult them; but due to that they deceive. One may whisper over oil that is in a vessel and one may not whisper over oil that is in hand. Therefore, one may smear oil from oil that in hand, and one may not smear oil that in a vessel,
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: The ministers of oil and the ministers of eggs are permitted to inquire about them, except because they are suspected of anointing with oil in a vessel, but they are not suspected of anointing with oil in the hand. Therefore, a knife is permitted from oil in the hand, but a knife is not permitted from oil in a vessel.

hebrew_text: רַב יִצְחָק בַּר שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר מָרְתָא אִיקְּלַע לְהָהוּא אוּשְׁפִּיזָא אַיְיתִי לֵיהּ מִישְׁחָא בְּמָנָא שָׁף (נָפְקָן) [נְפַקוּ] לֵיהּ צִימְחֵי בְּאַפֵּיהּ נְפַק לְשׁוּקָא חֲזֵיתֵיהּ הָהִיא אִיתְּתָא אֲמַרָה זִיקָא דְּחֵמֶת קָא חָזֵינָא הָכָא עֲבַדָא לֵיהּ מִלְּתָא וְאִיתַּסִּי
human_translation: Rav Yitzḥak bar Shmuel bar Marta happened to a certain inn, they brought him oil in a vessel. He rubbed it and boils developed on his face. He went out to the marketplace, and a certain woman saw him said: I see here the spirit Ḥamat She performed an action, for him, and he was healed.
llm_translation: Rav Yitzchak, son of Shmuel, son of Marta, happened upon a certain witch. He brought her a hair from the tail of a black cat. She took out some barley from her mouth and threw it to the ground. He saw that there was a certain fetus there. She said, "I see a vision of heat." He did something here and it disappeared.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי אַבָּא לְרַבָּה בַּר מָרִי כְּתִיב כׇּל הַמַּחֲלָה אֲשֶׁר שַׂמְתִּי בְמִצְרַיִם לֹא אָשִׂים עָלֶיךָ כִּי אֲנִי ה' רֹפְאֶךָ וְכִי מֵאַחַר שֶׁלֹּא שָׂם רְפוּאָה לָמָּה אֲמַר לֵיהּ הָכִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִקְרָא זֶה מֵעַצְמוֹ נִדְרָשׁ שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וַיֹּאמֶר אִם שָׁמוֹעַ תִּשְׁמַע לְקוֹל ה' אֱלֹהֶיךָ אִם תִּשְׁמַע  לֹא אָשִׂים וְאִם לֹא תִּשְׁמַע  אָשִׂים אַף עַל פִּי כֵן כִּי אֲנִי ה' רֹפְאֶךָ
human_translation: Rabbi Abba said to Rabba bar Mari It is written: “All the disease that I placed in Egypt I shall not place upon you, for I am the Lord, your Healer” And since does not place why is healing said to him this Rabbi Yoḥanan says: This verse can be interpreted from itself, as it is stated: “And He said: If you will diligently hearken to the voice of the Lord, your God” If you hearken I will not place and if you do not hearken I will place Nevertheless, “for I am the Lord, your Healer.”
llm_translation: He said to him, Rabbi Abba said to Rabba bar Mari: It is written, "I will not bring upon you any of the diseases I brought upon the Egyptians, for I am the Lord, your healer." And since He did not bring healing, why did He say so? He said to him: This is what Rabbi Yochanan said: This verse itself is interpreted, as it is said, "If you will diligently listen to the voice of the Lord your God, I will not bring upon you any of the diseases..." If you will listen - I will not bring; and if you will not listen - I will bring. Nevertheless, for I am the Lord, your healer.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה כְּשֶׁחָלָה רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר נִכְנְסוּ תַּלְמִידָיו לְבַקְּרוֹ אָמַר לָהֶן חֵמָה עַזָּה יֵשׁ בָּעוֹלָם הִתְחִילוּ הֵן בּוֹכִין וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא מְשַׂחֵק אָמְרוּ לוֹ לָמָּה אַתָּה מְשַׂחֵק אָמַר לָהֶן וְכִי מִפְּנֵי מָה אַתֶּם בּוֹכִים אָמְרוּ לוֹ אֶפְשָׁר סֵפֶר תּוֹרָה שָׁרוּי בְּצַעַר וְלֹא נִבְכֶּה
human_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana says: When Rabbi Eliezer fell ill, his students entered to visit him. said to them: There is intense wrath in the world, began to cry and Rabbi Akiva was laughing. They said to him: Why are you laughing? said to them: And for what are you crying? They said to him: possible a Torah scroll, is afflicted with pain and we will not cry?
llm_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said: When Rabbi Eliezer fell ill, his students came to visit him. He said to them, "There is fierce anger in the world." They began to cry, but Rabbi Akiva laughed. They said to him, "Why are you laughing?" He said to them, "And why are you crying?" They said to him, "Is it possible that the Torah scroll is placed in distress and we should not cry?"

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָהֶן לְכָךְ אֲנִי מְשַׂחֵק כׇּל זְמַן שֶׁאֲנִי רוֹאֶה רַבִּי שֶׁאֵין יֵינוֹ מַחְמִיץ וְאֵין פִּשְׁתָּנוֹ לוֹקֶה וְאֵין שַׁמְנוֹ מַבְאִישׁ וְאֵין דּוּבְשָׁנוֹ מַדְבִּישׁ אָמַרְתִּי 'שֶׁמָּא חַס וְשָׁלוֹם קִיבֵּל רַבִּי עוֹלָמוֹ' וְעַכְשָׁיו שֶׁאֲנִי רוֹאֶה רַבִּי בְּצַעַר  אֲנִי שָׂמֵחַ אָמַר לוֹ עֲקִיבָא כְּלוּם חִיסַּרְתִּי מִן הַתּוֹרָה כּוּלָּהּ אָמַר לוֹ לִימַּדְתָּנוּ רַבֵּינוּ 'כִּי אָדָם אֵין צַדִּיק בָּאָרֶץ אֲשֶׁר יַעֲשֶׂה טּוֹב וְלֹא יֶחֱטָא'
human_translation: said to them: for that I am laughing. As long as I would see my teacher that neither does his wine ferment nor is his flax stricken, nor does his oil spoil, nor does his honey turn rancid, I would say Perhaps, Heaven forfend, my teacher received his world But now that I see my teacher with suffering, I am happy. said to him: Akiva, have I failed of the entire Torah? said to him, you taught us, our teacher: “For there is not a righteous man upon earth who does good and sins not”
llm_translation: He said to them: "Therefore, I jest whenever I see Rabbi, that his wine does not turn sour, his flax does not get smitten, his oil does not spoil, and his honey does not ferment. I said, 'Perhaps Rabbi has accepted his world in peace.' But now that I see Rabbi in distress, I am happy." Akiva said to him: "You have caused us to lack nothing from the entire Torah." He said to him: "You have taught us, our teacher, 'For there is no righteous man on earth who does good and does not sin.'"

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן כְּשֶׁחָלָה רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר נִכְנְסוּ אַרְבָּעָה זְקֵנִים לְבַקְּרוֹ רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא
human_translation: The Sages taught When Rabbi Eliezer fell ill, four Sages entered to visit him: Rabbi Tarfon, and Rabbi Yehoshua, and Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya, and Rabbi Akiva.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: When Rabbi Eliezer fell ill, four elders entered to visit him: Rabbi Tarfon, Rabbi Yehoshua, Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah, and Rabbi Akiva.

hebrew_text: נַעֲנָה רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן וְאָמַר 'טוֹב אַתָּה לְיִשְׂרָאֵל מִטִּיפָּה שֶׁל גְּשָׁמִים שֶׁטִּיפָּה שֶׁל גְּשָׁמִים בָּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה וְרַבִּי בָּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה וּבָעוֹלָם הַבָּא'
human_translation: Rabbi Tarfon responded and said: You are better for the Jewish people than a drop of rain, as a drop of rain in this world, and my teacher in this world and in the World-to-Come.
llm_translation: Rabbi Tarfon answered and said, "You are good, Israel, from a drop of rain in this world, and Rabbi in this world and in the world to come."

hebrew_text: נַעֲנָה רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ וְאָמַר 'טוֹב אַתָּה לְיִשְׂרָאֵל יוֹתֵר מִגַּלְגַּל חַמָּה שֶׁגַּלְגַּל חַמָּה בָּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה וְרַבִּי בָּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה וּבָעוֹלָם הַבָּא'
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua responded and said: You are better for the Jewish people than the sphere of the sun, as the sphere of the sun in this world, and my teacher in this world and in the World-to-Come.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua answered and said, "Good are you to Israel more than the sun, for the sun shines in this world, and you shine in this world and in the world to come."

hebrew_text: נַעֲנָה רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה וְאָמַר 'טוֹב אַתָּה לְיִשְׂרָאֵל יוֹתֵר מֵאָב וָאֵם שֶׁאָב וָאֵם בָּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה וְרַבִּי בָּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה וּבָעוֹלָם הַבָּא'
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya responded and said: You are better for the Jewish people than a father and mother, as a father and mother in this world, my teacher in this world and in the World-to-Come.
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah responded and said, "You are more beneficial to Israel than a father and mother, for a father and mother in this world, but Rabbi in this world and in the world to come."

hebrew_text: נַעֲנָה רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא וְאָמַר 'חֲבִיבִין יִסּוּרִין' אָמַר לָהֶם 'סַמְּכוּנִי וְאֶשְׁמְעָה דִּבְרֵי עֲקִיבָא תַּלְמִידִי שֶׁאָמַר חֲבִיבִין יִסּוּרִין' אָמַר לוֹ 'עֲקִיבָא זוֹ מִנַּיִן לָךְ' אָמַר 'מִקְרָא אֲנִי דּוֹרֵשׁ בֶּן שְׁתֵּים עֶשְׂרֵה שָׁנָה מְנַשֶּׁה בְמׇלְכוֹ וַחֲמִשִּׁים וְחָמֵשׁ שָׁנָה מָלַךְ בִּירוּשָׁלִָים [וְגוֹ'] וַיַּעַשׂ הָרַע בְּעֵינֵי ה' וּכְתִיב
