human_translation: Rabbi Akiva responded and said: Afflictions are cherished. he said to Support me and hear the statement of Akiva my student, who said: Afflictions are cherished. said to him: Akiva, from where do you this? said: I interpret a verse “Manasseh was twelve years old when he began to reign and he reigned fifty-five years in Jerusalem…And he performed that which was evil in the eyes of the Lord” And it is written:
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva was answered and said, "Beloved are afflictions." He said to them, "Lean on me and I will hear the words of Akiva my teacher who said, 'Beloved are afflictions.'" They said to him, "Akiva, from where do you derive this?" He said, "I am one who interprets Scripture: 'A son of twelve years was Manasseh when he began to reign, and fifty and five years he reigned in Jerusalem and so on,' and he did evil in the eyes of the Lord, and it is written..."

hebrew_text: גַּם אֵלֶּה מִשְׁלֵי שְׁלֹמֹה אֲשֶׁר הֶעְתִּיקוּ אַנְשֵׁי חִזְקִיָּה מֶלֶךְ יְהוּדָה וְכִי חִזְקִיָּה מֶלֶךְ יְהוּדָה לְכׇל הָעוֹלָם כּוּלּוֹ לִימֵּד תּוֹרָה וְלִמְנַשֶּׁה בְּנוֹ לֹא לִימֵּד תּוֹרָה אֶלָּא מִכׇּל טוֹרַח שֶׁטָּרַח בּוֹ וּמִכׇּל עָמָל שֶׁעָמֵל בּוֹ לֹא הֶעֱלָהוּ לְמוּטָב אֶלָּא יִסּוּרִין שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וַיְדַבֵּר ה' אֶל מְנַשֶּׁה וְאֶל עַמּוֹ וְלֹא הִקְשִׁיבוּ וַיָּבֵא ה' עֲלֵיהֶם אֶת שָׂרֵי הַצָּבָא אֲשֶׁר לְמֶלֶךְ אַשּׁוּר וַיִּלְכְּדוּ אֶת מְנַשֶּׁה בַּחֹחִים וַיַּאַסְרֻהוּ בַּנְחֻשְׁתַּיִם וַיּוֹלִיכֻהוּ בָּבֶלָה
human_translation: “These too are the proverbs of Solomon, which the men of Hezekiah, king of Judea, copied” And Hezekiah, king of Judea, taught Torah to the entire world and to Manasseh his son he did not teach Torah? Rather, from all his exertion to him and from all his toil to him, only afflictions elevated him to good, as it is stated: “And the Lord spoke to Manasseh and to his people but they would not heed. And the Lord brought upon them the captains of the army of the king of Assyria, who took Manasseh with hooks, and bound him with chains, and carried him to Babylonia”
llm_translation: Also these proverbs of Solomon that the men of Hezekiah, king of Judah, copied. And when Hezekiah, king of Judah, became sick to the point of death, he taught his son Manasseh Torah. He did not teach him Torah except from all the toil that he toiled with, and from all the labor that he labored with. He did not raise him to good, but to sufferings, as it is said, "And the Lord spoke to Manasseh and to his people, but they did not listen, and the Lord brought upon them the commanders of the army of the king of Assyria, and they captured Manasseh with hooks, and bound him with bronze chains, and brought him to Babylon."

hebrew_text: וּכְתִיב וּכְהָצֵר לוֹ חִלָּה אֶת פְּנֵי ה' אֱלֹהָיו וַיִּכָּנַע מְאֹד מִלִּפְנֵי אֱלֹהֵי אֲבוֹתָיו וַיִּתְפַּלֵּל אֵלָיו וַיֵּעָתֶר לוֹ וַיִּשְׁמַע תְּחִנָּתוֹ וַיְשִׁיבֵהוּ יְרוּשָׁלִַים לְמַלְכוּתוֹ וַיֵּדַע מְנַשֶּׁה כִּי ה' הוּא הָאֱלֹהִים הָא לָמַדְתָּ שֶׁחֲבִיבִין יִסּוּרִין'
human_translation: And it is written “And when he was in distress, he sought the Lord his God, and humbled himself greatly before the God of his fathers, and he prayed to Him and He was entreated of him, and He heard his supplication, and brought him back to Jerusalem into his kingdom; then Manasseh knew that the Lord He was God” You learned this that afflictions are cherished.
llm_translation: And it is written, "And when he was in distress, he entreated the favor of the Lord his God and humbled himself greatly before the God of his fathers. He prayed to him, and God was moved by his entreaty and heard his plea and brought him back to Jerusalem to his kingdom. Then Manasseh knew that the Lord was God." (2 Chronicles 33:12-13)

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן שְׁלֹשָׁה בָּאוּ בַּעֲלִילָה אֵלּוּ הֵן קַיִן עֵשָׂו וּמְנַשֶּׁה קַיִן דִּכְתִיב 'גָּדוֹל עֲוֹנִי מִנְּשׂוֹא' אָמַר לְפָנָיו 'רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם כְּלוּם גָּדוֹל עֲוֹנִי מִשִּׁשִּׁים רִיבּוֹא שֶׁעֲתִידִין לַחְטוֹא לְפָנֶיךָ וְאַתָּה סוֹלֵחַ לָהֶם' עֵשָׂו דִּכְתִיב 'הַבְרָכָה אַחַת הִיא לָךְ אָבִי' מְנַשֶּׁה בַּתְּחִילָּה קָרָא לֶאֱלוֹהוֹת הַרְבֵּה וּלְבַסּוֹף קָרָא לֵאלֹהֵי אֲבוֹתָיו
human_translation: the Sages taught Three came with a demand, these are they: Cain, Esau, and Manasseh. Cain as it is written: “My sin is too great to bear” said before Master of the Universe, is my transgression greater than the 600,000 who are destined to sin before You and You forgive them? Esau as it is stated: “Have you but one blessing, my father?” initially he called to multiple gods, and ultimately he called to the God of his forefathers
llm_translation: The sages taught: Three individuals came with a complaint, these are they: Cain, Esau, and Manasseh. Cain, as it is written, "My punishment is too great to bear" (Genesis 4:13). He said before Him: "Master of the Universe, my sin is too great to be forgiven. You have decreed that sixty times the punishment of those who are destined to sin before You, and You forgive them." Esau, as it is written, "The blessing is one for you, my father" (Genesis 27:38). Manasseh initially called upon many gods, and in the end, he called upon the God of his fathers.

hebrew_text: אַבָּא שָׁאוּל אוֹמֵר אַף הַהוֹגֶה אֶת הַשֵּׁם בְּאוֹתִיּוֹתָיו וְכוּ' תָּנָא וּבַגְּבוּלִין וּבִלְשׁוֹן עָגָה
human_translation: Abba Shaul says: Also one who pronounces the name with its letters. taught in the outlying areas and in colloquial [ aga ] language,
llm_translation: Abba Shaul says: Even one who pronounces the Name with its letters, etc. It was taught: And in the borders, and in the language of Aggadah.

hebrew_text: שְׁלֹשָׁה מְלָכִים וְאַרְבָּעָה הֶדְיוֹטוֹת וְכוּ' תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן יָרׇבְעָם שֶׁרִיבֵּעַ עָם דָּבָר אַחֵר יָרׇבְעָם  שֶׁעָשָׂה מְרִיבָה בָּעָם דָּבָר אַחֵר יָרׇבְעָם  שֶׁעָשָׂה מְרִיבָה בֵּין יִשְׂרָאֵל לַאֲבִיהֶם שֶׁבַּשָּׁמַיִם בֶּן נְבָט  בֵּן שֶׁנִּיבַּט וְלֹא רָאָה
human_translation: three kings and four commoners The Sages taught Jeroboam [ Yorovam ] who debased people [ riba am ]. Alternatively, Yorovam who engendered strife among the people [ meriva ba’am ], Alternatively, Yorovam who engendered strife between the Jewish people [ meriva bein ha’am ] and their Heavenly Father, son of Nebat son who looked [ nibat ] but did not see
llm_translation: Three kings and four commoners, etc. The Rabbis taught: Jeroboam, who caused strife among the people. Another explanation: Jeroboam, who caused rebellion among the people. Another explanation: Jeroboam, who caused strife between Israel and their Father in Heaven. Ben Nebat, son of Nebat, and he did not see.

hebrew_text: תַּנָּא הוּא נְבָט הוּא מִיכָה הוּא שֶׁבַע בֶּן בִּכְרִי נְבָט  שֶׁנִּיבַּט וְלֹא רָאָה מִיכָה  שֶׁנִּתְמַכְמֵךְ בְּבִנְיָן וּמָה שְׁמוֹ  שֶׁבַע בֶּן בִּכְרִי שְׁמוֹ
human_translation: taught He is Nebat, he is Micah, he is Sheba, son of Bichri. Nebat, who looked [ nibat ] but did not see, Micah, who was crushed [ nitmakhmekh ] in the building And what is his name? His name is Sheba, son of Bichri.
llm_translation: It was taught: He is Nebat, he is Micah, he is Sheva son of Bichri. Nebat gazed but did not see, Micah leaned on a building. And what is his name? Sheva son of Bichri is his name.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן שְׁלֹשָׁה נִיבְּטוּ וְלֹא רָאוּ וְאֵלּוּ הֵן נְבָט וַאֲחִיתוֹפֶל וְאִיצְטַגְנִינֵי פַּרְעֹה
human_translation: The Sages taught Three looked but did not see And these are they: Nebat, and Ahithophel, and the astrologers of Pharaoh.
llm_translation: The sages taught: Three gazed but did not see, and they are: Nebat, Ahithophel, and Itstagninei Pharaoh.

hebrew_text: נְבָט רָאָה אֵשׁ שֶׁיּוֹצֵאת מֵאַמָּתוֹ הוּא סָבַר אִיהוּ מָלֵיךְ וְלָא הִיא יָרׇבְעָם הוּא דִּנְפַק מִינֵּיהּ
human_translation: Nebat saw fire that emerges from his penis. He thought he rule. But that is not would be Jeroboam who emerge from him
llm_translation: Nevat saw a fire coming out from his mother's womb, he thought it was he who was king, but it was not he, it was Jeroboam who came out from him.

hebrew_text: אֲחִיתוֹפֶל רָאָה צָרַעַת שֶׁזָּרְחָה לוֹ עַל אַמָּתוֹ הוּא סָבַר אִיהוּ מָלֵךְ וְלָא הִיא בַּת שֶׁבַע בִּתּוֹ הוּא דִּנְפַק מִינַּהּ שְׁלֹמֹה
human_translation: Ahithophel saw leprosy that glowed on his penis he thought he rule. But it is not so. from Bathsheba his daughter, came Solomon
llm_translation: Achitophel saw leprosy that shone on his elbow he thought he is king and not she Bathsheba his daughter he came out from her Solomon

hebrew_text: אִיצְטַגְנִינֵי פַּרְעֹה  דְּאָמַר רַבִּי חָמָא בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא מַאי דִּכְתִיב הֵמָּה מֵי מְרִיבָה  הֵמָּה שֶׁרָאוּ אִיצְטַגְנִינֵי פַּרְעֹה וְטָעוּ  רָאוּ שֶׁמּוֹשִׁיעָן שֶׁל יִשְׂרָאֵל בְּמַיִם הוּא לוֹקֶה אָמַר כׇּל הַבֵּן הַיִּלּוֹד הַיְאֹרָה תַּשְׁלִיכֻהוּ וְהֵן לֹא יָדְעוּ שֶׁעַל עִסְקֵי מֵי מְרִיבָה לוֹקֶה
human_translation: The astrologers of Pharaoh as Rabbi Ḥama, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, says: What which is written: “These are the waters of contention” These are that the astrologers of Pharaoh saw, and they erred they saw that the savior of Israel would be stricken by water, said: “Every son that is born you shall cast into the river” And they did not know that over matters the waters of Meribah stricken
llm_translation: The magicians of Pharaoh, as Rabbi Ḥama son of Rabbi Ḥanina said: What is the meaning of what is written, "They are the waters of Meribah"? They are the ones who saw the magicians of Pharaoh and erred. They saw that the one who saves the children of Israel with water is punished. He said: "Every son that is born, you shall cast into the river," and they did not know that he is punished for involving himself with the waters of Meribah.

hebrew_text: וּמְנָא לַן דְּלָא אָתֵי לְעָלְמָא דְּאָתֵי  דִּכְתִיב וַיְהִי בַּדָּבָר הַזֶּה לְחַטַּאת בֵּית יָרׇבְעָם וּלְהַכְחִיד וּלְהַשְׁמִיד מֵעַל פְּנֵי הָאֲדָמָה לְהַכְחִיד  בָּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה וּלְהַשְׁמִיד  לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא
human_translation: And from where do we that does not enter into the World-to-Come? as it is written: “And by this matter there was a sin to the house of Jeroboam, and to eradicate it and to destroy it from off the face of the earth” To eradicate it in this world, and to destroy it for the World-to-Come.
llm_translation: And count for us that he does not come to the world that he comes, as it is written, "And it was in this matter for the sin of the house of Jeroboam, to destroy and to annihilate from upon the face of the earth, to destroy in this world and to annihilate in the world to come."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִפְּנֵי מָה זָכָה יָרׇבְעָם לַמַּלְכוּת  מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוֹכִיחַ אֶת שְׁלֹמֹה וּמִפְּנֵי מָה נֶעֱנַשׁ  מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוֹכִיחוֹ בָּרַבִּים שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וְזֶה הַדָּבָר אֲשֶׁר הֵרִים יָד בַּמֶּלֶךְ שְׁלֹמֹה בָּנָה אֶת הַמִּלּוֹא סָגַר אֶת פֶּרֶץ עִיר דָּוִד אָבִיו אָמַר לוֹ דָּוִד אָבִיךָ פָּרַץ פְּרָצוֹת בַּחוֹמָה כְּדֵי שֶׁיַּעֲלוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל לָרֶגֶל וְאַתָּה גָּדַרְתָּ אוֹתָם כְּדֵי לַעֲשׂוֹת אַנְגַּרְיָא לְבַת פַּרְעֹה
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: For what was Jeroboam privileged to monarchy? due to that he rebuked Solomon And for what was he punished due to that he rebuked in public, as it is stated: “And this was the cause that he lifted his hand against the king: Solomon built the Millo, and repaired the breaches of the city of David his father” said to David, your father, created breaches in the wall so that the Jewish people could ascend for the pilgrimage Festival, and you sealed them in order to marshal forced labor [ angarya ] for the daughter of Pharaoh,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: For what reason did Jeroboam merit the kingship? Because he rebuked Solomon. And for what reason was he punished? Because he rebuked him in public, as it is stated: "And this is the thing that he lifted up his hand against the king: Solomon built the Millo, and closed up the breach of the city of David his father. And the king Solomon loved many strange women."

hebrew_text: וּמַאי וְזֶה אֲשֶׁר הֵרִים יָד בַּמֶּלֶךְ אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן שֶׁחָלַץ תְּפִילָּיו בְּפָנָיו אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן גַּסּוּת הָרוּחַ שֶׁהָיָה בּוֹ בְּיָרׇבְעָם טְרָדַתּוּ מִן הָעוֹלָם שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וַיֹּאמֶר יָרׇבְעָם בְּלִבּוֹ עַתָּה תָּשׁוּב הַמַּמְלָכָה לְבֵית דָּוִד אִם יַעֲלֶה הָעָם הַזֶּה לַעֲשׂוֹת זְבָחִים בְּבֵית ה' בִּירוּשָׁלִַים וְשָׁב לֵב הָעָם הַזֶּה אֶל אֲדֹנֵיהֶם אֶל רְחַבְעָם מֶלֶךְ יְהוּדָה וַהֲרָגֻנִי וְשָׁבוּ אֶל רְחַבְעָם מֶלֶךְ יְהוּדָה
human_translation: And what “and this was the cause that he lifted his hand against the king”? Rav Naḥman says: He removed his phylacteries before Rav Naḥman says: The arrogance that existed in Jeroboam drove him from the as it is stated: “And Jeroboam said in his heart: Now shall the kingdom return to the house of David. If this people go up to offer sacrifices in the House of the Lord in Jerusalem, then shall the heart of this people turn again to their lord, even to Rehoboam, king of Judea, and they shall kill me and return to Rehoboam, king of Judea”
llm_translation: And what is "And this is the thing that he lifted up his hand against the king"? Rav Nachman said: that he removed his prayer shawl in front of him. Rav Nachman said: the arrogance of spirit that was in him in Jeroboam caused his removal from the world, as it is said, "And Jeroboam said in his heart, 'Now the kingdom will return to the house of David. If this people go up to offer sacrifices in the house of the Lord at Jerusalem, then the heart of this people will return to their lord, to Rehoboam king of Judah, and they will kill me and return to Rehoboam king of Judah.'"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר גְּמִירִי דְּאֵין יְשִׁיבָה בַּעֲזָרָה אֶלָּא לְמַלְכֵי בֵּית יְהוּדָה בִּלְבָד כֵּיוָן דְּחָזוּ לֵיהּ לִרְחַבְעָם דְּיָתֵיב וַאֲנָא קָאֵימְנָא סָבְרִי הָא מַלְכָּא וְהָא עַבְדָּא וְאִי יָתֵיבְנָא  מוֹרֵד בַּמַּלְכוּת הוּא וְקָטְלִין לִי וְאָזְלוּ בָּתְרֵיהּ מִיָּד וַיִּוָּעַץ הַמֶּלֶךְ וַיַּעַשׂ שְׁנֵי עֶגְלֵי זָהָב וַיֹּאמֶר אֲלֵהֶם רַב לָכֶם מֵעֲלוֹת יְרוּשָׁלִַים הִנֵּה אֱלֹהֶיךָ יִשְׂרָאֵל אֲשֶׁר הֶעֱלוּךָ מֵאֶרֶץ מִצְרָיִם וַיָּשֶׂם אֶת הָאֶחָד בְּבֵית אֵל וְאֶת הָאֶחָד נָתַן בְּדָן
human_translation: said: It is learned that sitting in the Temple courtyard only for kings of the house of Judah alone. Once they see Rehoboam, who is sitting, and me standing, they will think: This, is king, and that, is the servant. And if I sit I will be a traitor against the throne, and they will kill me and follow him. Immediately, “And the king took counsel, and made two calves of gold, and said to them: It is too much for you to ascend to Jerusalem; behold your gods, Israel, who brought you up from the land of Egypt. And he placed the one in Bethel and the other he placed in Dan”
llm_translation: Gemiri said that there is no sitting in the Azarah except for the kings of the house of Judah alone, since they saw that Rehoboam was sitting, and I am standing. I think this king and that servant, and if we sit, it is rebellion against the kingdom, and they will kill me, and they immediately went away. The king consulted and made two golden calves and said to them, "It is too much for you to go up to Jerusalem. Here is your God, O Israel, who brought you up from the land of Egypt," and he placed one in Bethel and the other he put in Dan.

hebrew_text: מַאי וַיִּוָּעַץ אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה שֶׁהוֹשִׁיב רָשָׁע אֵצֶל צַדִּיק אֲמַר לְהוּ חָתְמִיתוּ עַל כֹּל דְּעָבֵידְנָא אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ הִין אֲמַר לְהוּ מַלְכָּא בָּעֵינָא לְמִיהְוֵי אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ הִין כֹּל דְּאָמֵינָא לְכוּ עָבֵידְתּוּ אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ הִין אֲפִילּוּ לְמִפְלַח לַעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה אֲמַר לֵיהּ צַדִּיק חַס וְחָלִילָה אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָשָׁע לְצַדִּיק סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ דְּגַבְרָא כְּיָרׇבְעָם פָּלַח לַעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה אֶלָּא לְמֵינְסִינְהוּ הוּא דְּקָא בָּעֵי אִי קַבְּלִיתוּ לְמֵימְרֵיהּ
human_translation: What “and took counsel”? Rabbi Yehuda says: that seated a wicked alongside a righteous He said Do you sign for all that I am doing? They said to him: Yes. He said to them: I want to be the king. They said to him: Yes. Will you do everything I tell you to do? They said to him: Yes. Even to worship idols? A righteous said: Heaven forfend; wicked said to the righteous Does it enter your mind that a man like Jeroboam worship idols? Rather, he seeks to test if they accept his pronouncements.
llm_translation: What is the meaning of "And he consulted"? Rabbi Yehuda said: When a wicked person sat next to a righteous person, he said to him, "Your signature is on everything we do." They said to him, "Yes." He said to them, "I want the king to be like me." They said to him, "Yes, everything that I believe you should do." They said to him, "Yes, even to offer incense in foreign worship?" He said to them, "A righteous person forbid! God forbid! May it never be!" He said to him, "Wicked one, may your mind be at ease, for you are like Jeroboam who caused them to offer incense in foreign worship, but it is I who desires it, not you."

hebrew_text: וְאַף אֲחִיָּה הַשִּׁילוֹנִי טָעָה וְחָתַם דְּהָא יֵהוּא צַדִּיקָא רַבָּה הֲוָה שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וַיֹּאמֶר ה' אֶל יֵהוּא יַעַן אֲשֶׁר הֱטִיבֹתָ לַעֲשׂוֹת הַיָּשָׁר בְּעֵינַי כְּכֹל אֲשֶׁר בִּלְבָבִי עָשִׂיתָ לְבֵית אַחְאָב בְּנֵי רְבִעִים יֵשְׁבוּ לְךָ עַל כִּסֵּא יִשְׂרָאֵל וּכְתִיב וְיֵהוּא לֹא שָׁמַר לָלֶכֶת בְּתוֹרַת ה' אֱלֹהֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל בְּכׇל לְבָבוֹ לֹא סָר מֵעַל חַטֹּאות יָרׇבְעָם אֲשֶׁר הֶחֱטִיא אֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל
human_translation: And even Ahijah the Shilonite erred and signed As Jehu was an extremely righteous person. As it is stated: “And the Lord said to Jehu: Because you have done well, to perform what is right in My eyes, and have done to the house of Ahab according to all that was in My heart, your children of the fourth generation shall sit on the throne of Israel” And it is written: “But Jehu took no care to walk in the Torah of the Lord, God of Israel, with all his heart; he departed not from the sins of Jeroboam, who made Israel sin”
llm_translation: And also Ahijah the Shilonite erred and sealed for Yehu the righteous great, as it is said, "And the Lord said to Yehu, 'Because you have done well in doing what is right in My eyes, according to all that was in My heart you have done to the house of Ahab, sons of the fourth generation shall sit for you on the throne of Israel.' And it is written, 'But Yehu did not take heed to walk in the Torah of the Lord God of Israel with all his heart; he did not turn away from the sins of Jeroboam, who had caused Israel to sin.'"

hebrew_text: מַאי גְּרַמָא לֵיהּ אָמַר אַבָּיֵי בְּרִית כְּרוּתָה לַשְּׂפָתַיִם שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר אַחְאָב עָבַד אֶת הַבַּעַל מְעָט יֵהוּא יַעַבְדֶנּוּ הַרְבֵּה רָבָא אָמַר חוֹתָמוֹ שֶׁל אֲחִיָּה הַשִּׁילוֹנִי רָאָה וְטָעָה
human_translation: What caused Abaye says: A covenant is made with the lips, as it is stated “Ahab worshipped Baal a little, but Jehu shall serve him much” Rava says: He saw the seal of Ahijah the Shilonite and he erred
llm_translation: What is the cause for it? Abaye said: A covenant sealed to the lips, as it is stated, "Achav served the Baal a little, Jehu will serve him much." Rava said: The signet ring of Achiya the Shilonite he saw and erred.

hebrew_text: דִּכְתִיב וְשַׁחֲטָה שֵׂטִים הֶעְמִיקוּ וַאֲנִי מוּסָר לְכֻלָּם אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא הֵם הַעֲמִיקוּ מִשֶּׁלִּי אֲנִי אָמַרְתִּי כֹּל שֶׁאֵינוֹ עוֹלֶה לָרֶגֶל  עוֹבֵר בַּעֲשֵׂה וְהֵם אָמְרוּ כׇּל הָעוֹלֶה לָרֶגֶל יִדָּקֵר בַּחֶרֶב
human_translation: which is written: “And the apostates are deep in slaughter and I am rejected by them all” Rabbi Yoḥanan says the Holy One, Blessed be He, says: They more profound than my own. I said: Anyone who does not ascend for the pilgrimage Festival violates a positive mitzva, and they said: Anyone who ascends for the pilgrimage Festival will be stabbed with the sword.
llm_translation: It is written: "And the Setim shall hew them down." They delved deeply, and I am responsible for all of them. Rabbi Yochanan said: The Holy One, blessed be He, said, "They delved deeper than I did." I say: Anyone who does not go up to the pilgrimage festival transgresses a positive commandment, and they said: "Anyone who goes up to the pilgrimage festival will be pierced with the sword."

hebrew_text: וַיְהִי בָּעֵת הַהִיא וְיָרׇבְעָם יָצָא מִירוּשָׁלִָים וַיִּמְצָא אֹתוֹ אֲחִיָּה הַשִּׁילוֹנִי הַנָּבִיא בַּדֶּרֶךְ וְהוּא מִתְכַּסֶּה בְּשַׂלְמָה חֲדָשָׁה תָּנָא מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יוֹסֵי עֵת הִיא מְזוּמֶּנֶת לְפוּרְעָנוּת
human_translation: “And it came to pass at that time, and Jeroboam left Jerusalem, and the prophet Ahijah the Shilonite found him on the way, and he was clad in a new garment, taught in the name of Rabbi Yosei: it is a time ordained for calamity.
llm_translation: And it was at that time, and Jeroboam went out from Jerusalem, and he found him Ahijah the Shilonite the prophet on the way, and he was covering himself with a new garment. It was taught in the name of Rabbi Yosei: "That time was designated for punishment."

hebrew_text: בְּעֵת פְּקֻדָּתָם יֹאבֵדוּ תָּנָא מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יוֹסֵי עֵת מְזוּמֶּנֶת לְפוּרְעָנוּת בְּעֵת רָצוֹן עֲנִיתִיךָ תָּנָא מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יוֹסֵי עֵת מְזוּמֶּנֶת לְטוֹבָה וּבְיוֹם פׇּקְדִי וּפָקַדְתִּי עֲלֵהֶם חַטֹּאתָם תָּנָא מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יוֹסֵי עֵת הִיא מְזוּמֶּנֶת לְפוּרְעָנוּת וַיְהִי בָּעֵת הַהִיא וַיֵּרֶד יְהוּדָה מֵאֵת אֶחָיו תָּנָא מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יוֹסֵי עֵת מְזוּמֶּנֶת לְפוּרְעָנוּת
human_translation: “At the time of their punishment, they shall perish” taught in the name of Rabbi Yosei: a time ordained for calamity. “In an acceptable time have I answered you” taught in the name of Rabbi Yosei: a time ordained for good. “On the day when I punish, I will punish their sin upon them” taught in the name of Rabbi Yosei: it is a time ordained for calamity. “And it came to pass at that time, and Judah descended from his brothers” taught in the name of Rabbi Yosei: a time ordained for calamity.
llm_translation: At the time of their visitation they shall perish. A Tanna taught in the name of Rabbi Yosei: A predetermined time for punishment. At a time of favor, I answered you. A Tanna taught in the name of Rabbi Yosei: A predetermined time for good. "And in the day of My visitation, I will visit upon them their sin." A Tanna taught in the name of Rabbi Yosei: It is a predetermined time for punishment. And it came to pass at that time that Judah went down from his brothers. A Tanna taught in the name of Rabbi Yosei: A predetermined time for punishment.

hebrew_text: וַיֵּלֶךְ רְחַבְעָם שְׁכֶם כִּי שְׁכֶם בָּא כׇל יִשְׂרָאֵל לְהַמְלִיךְ אֹתוֹ תָּנָא מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יוֹסֵי מָקוֹם מְזוּמָּן לְפוּרְעָנוּת בִּשְׁכֶם עִינּוּ אֶת דִּינָה בִּשְׁכֶם מָכְרוּ אֶחָיו אֶת יוֹסֵף בִּשְׁכֶם נֶחְלְקָה מַלְכוּת בֵּית דָּוִד
human_translation: “And Rehoboam went to Shechem; for all Israel came to Shechem, to make him king” taught in the name of Rabbi Yosei: a place ordained for calamity. In Shechem, they tormented Dinah, in Shechem the brothers sold Joseph, in Shechem the kingdom of the house of David was divided.
llm_translation: Rechavam went to Shechem, for Shechem was the place where all of Israel came to crown him. It was taught in the name of Rabbi Yosei: Shechem was designated as the location for retribution, for in Shechem his brothers sold Yosef. In Shechem the kingdom of the House of David was divided.

hebrew_text: וְיָרׇבְעָם יָצָא מִירוּשָׁלָיִם אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בַּר פָּפָּא שֶׁיָּצָא מִפִּיתְקָהּ שֶׁל יְרוּשָׁלַיִם
human_translation: “And Jeroboam left Jerusalem” Rabbi Ḥanina bar Pappa says: that he left the destiny of Jerusalem,
llm_translation: "And Jeroboam went out from Jerusalem. Rabbi Chanina bar Papa said: He went out from the bakery of Jerusalem."

hebrew_text: וַיִּמְצָא אֹתוֹ אֲחִיָּה הַשִּׁילוֹנִי הַנָּבִיא בַּדֶּרֶךְ וְהוּא מִתְכַּסֶּה בְּשַׂלְמָה חֲדָשָׁה וּשְׁנֵיהֶם לְבַדָּם בַּשָּׂדֶה מַאי בְּשַׂלְמָה חֲדָשָׁה אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן כְּשַׂלְמָה חֲדָשָׁה מָה שַׂלְמָה חֲדָשָׁה אֵין בָּהּ שׁוּם דּוֹפִי  אַף תּוֹרָתוֹ שֶׁל יָרׇבְעָם לֹא הָיָה בָּהּ שׁוּם דּוֹפִי דָּבָר אַחֵר שַׂלְמָה חֲדָשָׁה  שֶׁחִידְּשׁוּ דְּבָרִים שֶׁלֹּא שָׁמְעָה אֹזֶן מֵעוֹלָם
human_translation: “And the prophet Ahijah the Shilonite found him on the way, and he was clad in a new [ ḥadasha ] garment, and the two were alone in the field.” What “in a new garment”? Rav Naḥman says: like a new garment; just as a new garment has no imperfection, so too, the Torah of Jeroboam had no imperfection. Alternatively, “a new garment” that they introduced [ sheḥideshu ] matters that ear had ever heard.
llm_translation: And he found him Ahijah the Shilonite the prophet on the way, and he was covering himself with a new garment, and the two of them alone in the field. What is a new garment? Rav Nachman said: Like a new garment, what is in it no blemish. So too, the Torah of Jeroboam had in it no blemish. Another explanation of a new garment is that they introduced matters that no ear has ever heard.

hebrew_text: מַאי וּשְׁנֵיהֶם לְבַדָּם בַּשָּׂדֶה אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב שֶׁכׇּל תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים דּוֹמִין לִפְנֵיהֶם כְּעִשְׂבֵי הַשָּׂדֶה וְאִיכָּא דְּאָמַר שֶׁכׇּל טַעֲמֵי תּוֹרָה מְגוּלִּין לָהֶם כַּשָּׂדֶה
human_translation: What “and the two were alone in the field”? Rav Yehuda says Rav says: that all Torah scholars seemed, to them, like grass of the field, And there are who say: that all the rationales of the Torah were revealed to them like a field
llm_translation: What is "and both of them alone in the field"? Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: All students of the sages are similar to the grasses of the field before them, and there are those who say: All flavors of Torah are revealed to them like the field.

hebrew_text: לָכֵן תִּתְּנִי שִׁלּוּחִים עַל מוֹרֶשֶׁת גַּת בָּתֵּי אַכְזִיב לְאַכְזָב לְמַלְכֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בַּר פָּפָּא יָצְאָה בַּת קוֹל וְאָמְרָה לָהֶן מִי שֶׁהָרַג אֶת הַפְּלִשְׁתִּי וְהוֹרִישׁ אֶתְכֶם גַּת תִּתְּנוּ שִׁילּוּחִים לְבָנָיו 'בָּתֵּי אַכְזִיב לְאַכְזָב לְמַלְכֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל'
human_translation: “Therefore shall you give parting gifts to Moresheth Gath; the houses of Achzib are a deceitful thing for the kings of Israel” Rabbi Ḥanina bar Pappa says: a Divine Voice emerged and said to He who killed the Philistine and bequeathed Gath to you, will you give parting gifts to his sons the houses of Achzib are a deceitful thing for the kings of Israel,
llm_translation: Therefore, you shall give fields as a possession in Gath-rimmon to the Levites, the cities of refuge, and Acco with its pasturelands, to the kings of Israel. Rabbi Chanina bar Papa said: A heavenly voice came forth and said to them, "Whoever killed the Philistine and caused you to inherit Gath, give fields as a possession to his sons in Acco and its pasturelands to the kings of Israel."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בַּר פָּפָּא כׇּל הַנֶּהֱנֶה מִן הָעוֹלָם הַזֶּה בְּלֹא בְּרָכָה כְּאִילּוּ גּוֹזֵל לְהַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא וּכְנֶסֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל  שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר גּוֹזֵל אָבִיו וְאִמּוֹ וְאֹמֵר אֵין פָּשַׁע חָבֵר הוּא לְאִישׁ מַשְׁחִית וְאֵין אָבִיו אֶלָּא הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר הֲלֹא הוּא אָבִיךְ קָּנֶךָ וְאֵין אִמּוֹ אֶלָּא כְּנֶסֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר שְׁמַע בְּנִי מוּסַר אָבִיךָ וְאַל תִּטֹּשׁ תּוֹרַת אִמֶּךָ
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina bar Pappa says: anyone who derives benefit from this world without a blessing, it is as though he stole from the Holy One, Blessed be He, and the congregation of Israel, as it is stated: “Whoever robs his father and his mother and says: It is no transgression, he is the companion of a corrupter” And “his father” none other than the Holy One, Blessed be He, as it is stated: “Is He not your Father Who created you, And “his mother” none other than the congregation of Israel, as it is stated: “Hear, my son, the discipline of your father, and do not forsake the Torah of your mother”
llm_translation: Rabbi Chanina bar Papa said: Anyone who benefits from this world without a blessing, it is as if he has stolen from the Holy One, blessed be He, and from the congregation of Israel. As it is stated, "He steals his father and his mother, and says, 'It is not transgression,' he is a companion to a man who destroys" (Proverbs 28:24). And his father is none other than the Holy One, blessed be He, as it is stated, "Is He not your Father who acquired you?" (Deuteronomy 32:6). And his mother is none other than the congregation of Israel, as it is stated, "Hear, my son, the discipline of your father, and do not forsake the teaching of your mother" (Proverbs 1:8).

hebrew_text: מַאי חָבֵר הוּא לְאִישׁ מַשְׁחִית  חָבֵר הוּא לְיָרׇבְעָם בֶּן נְבָט שֶׁהִשְׁחִית יִשְׂרָאֵל לַאֲבִיהֶם שֶׁבַּשָּׁמַיִם
human_translation: What “He is the companion of a corrupter”? he is a companion of Jeroboam, son of Nebat, who corrupted Israel before their Father in Heaven
llm_translation: What is the association of a companion to a man of destruction? He is a companion to Jeroboam son of Nebat, who caused Israel to sin against their Father in Heaven.

hebrew_text: וְיַדַּח יָרׇבְעָם (בֶּן נְבָט) אֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל מֵאַחֲרֵי ה' וְהֶחֱטִיאָם חֲטָאָה גְדוֹלָה אָמַר רַבִּי חָנִין כִּשְׁתֵּי מַקְלוֹת הַמַּתִּיזוֹת זוֹ אֶת זוֹ
human_translation: “And Jeroboam drove Israel from following the Lord, and caused them to sin a great sin” Rabbi Ḥanin says: like two sticks cause each other to carom,
llm_translation: And Jeroboam (son of Nebat) pushed Israel away from the Lord, and he caused them to sin a great sin. Rabbi Chaninah said: Like two sticks that strike one another.

hebrew_text: וְדִי זָהָב אָמְרוּ דְּבֵי רַבִּי יַנַּאי אָמַר מֹשֶׁה לִפְנֵי הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם בִּשְׁבִיל כֶּסֶף וְזָהָב שֶׁהִשְׁפַּעְתָּ לָהֶן לְיִשְׂרָאֵל עַד שֶׁיֹּאמְרוּ 'דַּיי'  גָּרַם לָהֶם לַעֲשׂוֹת לָהֶם אֱלֹהֵי זָהָב מָשָׁל אֵין אֲרִי דּוֹרֵס וְנוֹהֵם מִתּוֹךְ קוּפָּה שֶׁל תֶּבֶן אֶלָּא מִתּוֹךְ קוּפָּה שֶׁל בָּשָׂר
human_translation: “And Di Zahav” The school of Rabbi Yannai said: Moses said before the Holy One, Blessed be He: Master of the Universe, because of the gold and silver that You lavished upon the Jewish people until they said enough [ dai ], caused the Jewish people to fashion for themselves gods of gold. a parable A lion does not maul and roar over a basket of straw rather, over a basket of meat,
llm_translation: "And of gold, the House of Rabbi Yannai said: Moses said before the Holy One, blessed be He: Master of the universe, for the sake of the silver and gold that You have bestowed upon Israel until they said 'enough,' You caused them to make for themselves a golden god. A parable: A lion does not roar and growl from within a straw basket, but from within a basket of flesh."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא עַד יָרׇבְעָם הָיוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל יוֹנְקִים מֵעֵגֶל אֶחָד מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ מִשְּׁנַיִם וּשְׁלֹשָׁה עֲגָלִים אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק אֵין לָךְ כׇּל פּוּרְעָנוּת וּפוּרְעָנוּת שֶׁבָּאָה לְעוֹלָם שֶׁאֵין בָּהּ אֶחָד מֵעֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבָּעָה בְּהֶכְרֵעַ לִיטְרָא שֶׁל עֵגֶל הָרִאשׁוֹן שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וּבְיוֹם פׇּקְדִי וּפָקַדְתִּי עֲלֵהֶם חַטֹּאתָם
human_translation: Rabbi Oshaya says: Until Jeroboam, Israel was suckling, from one calf From that forward, from two and three calves, Rabbi Yitzḥak says: You have no punishment that comes to the world in which there is not one twenty-fourth of the surplus of a litra of the first calf. as it is stated: “On the day when I punish, I will punish their sin upon them”
llm_translation: Rabbi Oshaya said: Until Jeroboam, the Israelites were nursing from one calf, from here and onwards from two and three calves. Rabbi Yitzchak said: You have no affliction and no affliction that comes to the world that does not have one out of twenty-fourth part in it of the calf's thigh of the first one, as it is stated, "And on the day of My visitation, I will visit upon them their sin."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא לְאַחַר עֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבָּעָה דּוֹרוֹת נִגְבָּה פָּסוּק זֶה שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וַיִּקְרָא בְאׇזְנַי קוֹל גָּדוֹל לֵאמֹר קָרְבוּ פְּקֻדּוֹת הָעִיר וְאִישׁ כְּלִי מַשְׁחֵתוֹ בְּיָדוֹ
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina says: After twenty-four generations this verse was collected, as it is stated: “And he cried in my ears with a loud voice, saying: Those who have charge over the city draw near, every man with his deadly weapon in his hand”
llm_translation: Rabbi Chanina said: After twenty-four generations, this verse ceased, as it is stated, "And He called in my ears with a loud voice, saying, 'Approach the officials of the city, each with his destroying weapon in his hand.'"

hebrew_text: אַחַר הַדָּבָר הַזֶּה לֹא שָׁב יָרׇבְעָם מִדַּרְכּוֹ הָרָעָה מַאי אַחַר אָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא אַחַר שֶׁתְּפָשׂוֹ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לְיָרׇבְעָם בְּבִגְדוֹ וְאָמַר לוֹ חֲזוֹר בְּךָ וַאֲנִי וְאַתָּה וּבֶן יִשַׁי נְטַיֵּיל בְּגַן עֵדֶן אָמַר לוֹ מִי בָּרֹאשׁ בֶּן יִשַׁי בָּרֹאשׁ אִי הָכִי לָא בָּעֵינָא
human_translation: “And after this matter, Jeroboam returned not from his evil way” what “After Rabbi Abba says: after the Holy One, Blessed be He, grabbed Jeroboam by his garment, and said to him: Repent, and you and I and son of Yishai will stroll in the Garden of Eden. said to Him: Who in the lead? said to son of Yishai in the lead. If so, I do not wish
llm_translation: After this matter, Jeroboam did not turn back from his evil way. What is meant by "after"? Rabbi Abba said: After the Holy One, blessed be He, caught Jeroboam by his garment and said to him, "Repent, and I and you and the son of Jesse will stroll in the Garden of Eden." He said to Him, "Who is at the head?" "The son of Jesse is at the head." If so, I do not desire it.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ הֲוָה רְגִיל דַּהֲוָה קָא דָרֵישׁ בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה מְלָכִים חֲלַשׁ קַבֵּיל עֲלֵיהּ דְּלָא דָּרֵישׁ כֵּיוָן
human_translation: Rabbi Abbahu was accustomed to lecture about the three kings He fell ill, and he undertook that he would not lecture Once
llm_translation: Rabbi Avahu used to be accustomed that he was expounding with three kings weak he would accept upon it that he would not expound once

hebrew_text: דְּאִתְּפַח הֲדַר קָא דָרֵישׁ אָמְרִי לָא קַבֵּילְתְּ עֲלָךְ דְּלָא דָּרְשַׁתְּ בְּהוּ אָמַר אִינְהוּ מִי הֲדַרוּ בְּהוּ דַּאֲנָא אֶהְדַּר בִּי
human_translation: he recovered, he then lectured said to him: Did you not undertake that you will not lecture about them? said: Did they repent, that I will reconsider
llm_translation: The text reads: "De'itpach hadar ka dareish amrei la kabilta alach de lo darshta behu amar inhu mi hadaru behu da'ana eh'dar bi." Translation: "When he turned away, he began to expound, saying, 'I did not accept upon you that you did not expound on it.' They said, 'Who turned away from it? I will turn back to it.'"

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אוֹקֵי אַשְּׁלֹשָׁה מְלָכִים אֲמַר לִמְחַר נִפְתַּח בְּחַבְרִין אֲתָא מְנַשֶּׁה אִיתְחֲזִי לֵיהּ בְּחֶלְמֵיהּ אָמַר חֲבֵרָךְ וַחֲבֵירֵי דַּאֲבוּךְ קָרֵית לַן
human_translation: Rav Ashi ended of the three kings. He said Tomorrow we will begin with our colleagues Manasseh, came and appeared to him in his dream. said You called us your colleague and the colleagues of your father?
llm_translation: Rav Ashei examines three kings. He said, "Tomorrow we will open in the study hall." Menasheh came, he appeared to him in his dream. His friend said, "And the friends of your father have you called to us."

hebrew_text: מֵהֵיכָא בָּעֵית לְמִישְׁרֵא הַמּוֹצִיא אֲמַר לֵיהּ לָא יָדַעְנָא אֲמַר לֵיהּ מֵהֵיכָא דְּבָעֵית לְמִישְׁרֵא הַמּוֹצִיא לָא גְּמִירַתְּ וַ'חֲבֵרָךְ' קָרֵית לַן אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַגְמְרֵיהּ לִי וְלִמְחַר דָּרֵישְׁנָא לֵיהּ מִשְּׁמָךְ בְּפִירְקָא אֲמַר לֵיהּ מֵהֵיכָא דְּקָרֵים בִּישּׁוּלָא
human_translation: from where are you required to begin Who brings forth said to him: I do not know. said to him: from where you are required to begin Who brings forth you did not learn, and you call us your colleague? said to Teach me and tomorrow I will lecture it in your name during lecture said to him: from where it crusts baking.
llm_translation: From where do you want to draw a straight line? The one who is speaking said to him, "I do not know." He said to him, "From where do you want to draw a straight line? The one who is speaking does not complete it, and 'your friend' you have called us." He said to him, "Complete it for me, and tomorrow I will expound it to you from your name in the chapter." He said to him, "From where do you call in the market?"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ מֵאַחַר דְּחַכִּימַתְּ כּוּלֵּי הַאי מַאי טַעְמָא קָא פָּלְחִיתוּ לַעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה אֲמַר לֵיהּ אִי הֲוֵת הָתָם הֲוֵת נָקֵיטְ(נא) בְּשִׁיפּוּלֵי גְּלִימָא וְרָהֲטַתְּ אַבַּתְרַאי לִמְחַר אֲמַר לְהוּ לְרַבָּנַן נִפְתָּח בְּרַבְּווֹתָא
human_translation: said to him: Since you were so wise, what is the reason you engaged in idol worship? said to him: Had you been there you would have taken the hem of your cloak and run after me The next day said to the Sages We will begin with our teachers,
llm_translation: He said to him, "After you have become wise, why did you engage in this? What reason did you have to involve yourself in idol worship?" He said to him, "If you had been there, you would have taken hold of the edges of the cloak and run after me to the next day." He said to the Rabbis, "It opened with a multitude."

hebrew_text: אַחְאָב אָח לַשָּׁמַיִם אָב לַעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה אָח לַשָּׁמַיִם דִּכְתִיב אָח לְצָרָה יִוָּלֵד אָב לַעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה דִּכְתִיב כְּרַחֵם אָב עַל בָּנִים
human_translation: Ahab [ Aḥav ], a brother [ aḥ ] to Heaven, a father [ av ] for idol worship. a brother to Heaven, as it is written: “And a brother is born for adversity” a father for idolatry. as it is written: “As a father has compassion for his children”
llm_translation: Achav brother to the heavens, father to idolatry. Brother to the heavens, as it is written, "a brother to distress is born." Father to idolatry, as it is written, "like a father has compassion on his children."

hebrew_text: וַיְהִי הֲנָקֵל לֶכְתּוֹ בְּחַטֹּאות יָרׇבְעָם בֶּן נְבָט אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן קַלּוֹת שֶׁעָשָׂה אַחְאָב כַּחֲמוּרוֹת שֶׁעָשָׂה יָרׇבְעָם וּמִפְּנֵי מָה תָּלָה הַכָּתוּב בְּיָרׇבְעָם  מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוּא הָיָה תְּחִילָּה לַקַּלְקָלָה גַּם מִזְבְּחוֹתָם כְּגַלִּים עַל תַּלְמֵי שָׂדָי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אֵין לָךְ כׇּל תֶּלֶם וָתֶלֶם בְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁלֹּא הֶעֱמִיד עָלָיו אַחְאָב עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה וְהִשְׁתַּחֲוָה לָהּ
human_translation: “And it came to pass, the most minor of his transgressions was his walking in the sins of Jeroboam, son of Nebat” Rabbi Yoḥanan says: The minor that Ahab performed on par with the major that Jeroboam performed, And for what did the verse attribute to Jeroboam, due to that he was first to iniquity. “Their altars shall also be like droppings in the furrows of the field” Rabbi Yoḥanan says: You do not have even one furrow in Eretz Yisrael upon which Ahab did not place idol worship and bow to it.
llm_translation: And it was light for him to walk in the sins of Jeroboam son of Nebat. Rabbi Yochanan said: The light sins that Ahab did are like the heavy sins that Jeroboam did. And why does the Scripture hang the blame on Jeroboam? Because he was the first to cause corruption, even from their altars, like heaps in the furrows of the field. Rabbi Yochanan said: There is no mound and no mound in the land of Israel that Ahab did not establish foreign worship upon it and bow down to it.

hebrew_text: וּמְנָא לַן דְּלָא אָתֵי לְעָלְמָא דְּאָתֵי דִּכְתִיב וְהִכְרַתִּי לְאַחְאָב מַשְׁתִּין בְּקִיר וְעָצוּר וְעָזוּב בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל עָצוּר  בָּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה וְעָזוּב  לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא
human_translation: And from where do we that does not enter into the World-to-Come? as it is written: “And I will excise from Ahab every man, and him that is shut up and him that is abandoned in Israel” “Him that is shut up” in this world, “and him that is abandoned” in the World-to-Come.
llm_translation: And count for us that he does not come to the world that he comes for it, as it is written, "And I will cut off Ahab from the wall and the one who urinates against the wall and the one who is shut up and the one who is abandoned in Israel, shut up in this world and abandoned in the world to come."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִפְּנֵי מָה זָכָה עׇמְרִי לַמַּלְכוּת  מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוֹסִיף כְּרַךְ אֶחָד בְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וַיִּקֶן אֶת הָהָר שֹׁמְרוֹן מֵאֶת שֶׁמֶר בְּכִכְּרַיִם כָּסֶף וַיִּבֶן אֶת הָהָר וַיִּקְרָא [אֶת] שֵׁם הָעִיר אֲשֶׁר בָּנָה עַל שֶׁם שֶׁמֶר אֲדֹנֵי הָהָר שֹׁמְרוֹן
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: For what was Omri, privileged to monarchy? due to that he added one city in Eretz Yisrael, as it is stated: “And he bought the hill of Samaria from Shemer for two talents of silver, and built on the hill, and called the name of the city that he built after Shemer, the owner of the hill, Samaria”
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: For what reason did Omri merit the kingship? Because he added one city in the land of Israel, as it is stated: "And he bought the hill of Shomron from Shemer for two talents of silver, and he built on the hill, and he called the name of the city that he built Shomron, after the name of Shemer, the owner of the hill, Shomron."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִפְּנֵי מָה זָכָה אַחְאָב לַמַּלְכוּת עֶשְׂרִים וּשְׁתַּיִם שָׁנָה
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: For what was Ahab privileged to monarchy twenty-two years?
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: "For what reason did Achav merit the kingdom for twenty-two years?"

hebrew_text: מִפְּנֵי שֶׁכִּיבֵּד אֶת הַתּוֹרָה שֶׁנִּיתְּנָה בְּעֶשְׂרִים וּשְׁתַּיִם אוֹתִיּוֹת  שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וַיִּשְׁלַח מַלְאָכִים אֶל אַחְאָב מֶלֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵל הָעִירָה וַיֹּאמֶר לוֹ כֹּה אָמַר בֶּן הֲדַד כַּסְפְּךָ וּזְהָבְךָ לִי הוּא וְנָשֶׁיךָ וּבָנֶיךָ הַטּוֹבִים לִי הֵם כִּי אִם כָּעֵת מָחָר אֶשְׁלַח אֶת עֲבָדַי אֵלֶיךָ וְחִפְּשׂוּ אֶת בֵּיתְךָ וְאֵת בָּתֵּי עֲבָדֶיךָ וְהָיָה כׇּל מַחְמַד עֵינֶיךָ יָשִׂימוּ בְיָדָם וְלָקָחוּ וַיֹּאמֶר לְמַלְאֲכֵי בֶן הֲדַד אִמְרוּ לַאדֹנִי הַמֶּלֶךְ כֹּל אֲשֶׁר שָׁלַחְתָּ (לְעַבְדְּךָ) [אֶל עַבְדְּךָ] בָרִאשׁוֹנָה אֶעֱשֶׂה וְהַדָּבָר הַזֶּה לֹא אוּכַל לַעֲשׂוֹת
human_translation: due to that he respected the Torah, which was given with twenty-two letters, as it is stated: “And he sent messengers to Ahab, king of Israel, into the city, and said to him: So says Ben-Hadad: Your silver and your gold are mine; your wives and also your good children, are mine. Yet I will send my servants to you tomorrow about this time, and they shall search your house, and the houses of your servants, and it shall be, that they shall put in their hand all the delight of your eyes and take it…And he said to the messengers of Ben-Hadad, tell my lord the king: All that you did send for to your servant at the first I will do; but this thing I may not do”
llm_translation: Because he honored the Torah that was given with twenty-two letters, as it is stated, "And he sent messengers to Ahab king of Israel into the city, and said to him, 'Thus says Ben-hadad: Your silver and your gold are mine, and your best wives and children are mine.'" For now, tomorrow, I will send my servants to you, and they will search your house and the houses of your servants, and all that is precious in your eyes they will take in their hand and carry away." And he said to the messengers of Ben-hadad, "Say to my lord the king, 'All that you sent to your servant at first, I will do, but this thing I cannot do.'"

hebrew_text: מַאי מַחְמַד עֵינֶיךָ לָאו סֵפֶר תּוֹרָה
human_translation: What “the delight of your eyes” Is it not a Torah scroll?
llm_translation: What is the delight of your eyes? Is it not the Torah scroll?

hebrew_text: דִּילְמָא עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה לָא סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ דִּכְתִיב וַיֹּאמְרוּ אֵלָיו כׇּל הַזְּקֵנִים וְכׇל הָעָם לֹא תֹאבֶה וְלֹא תִשְׁמַע וְדִילְמָא סָבֵי דְּבַהֲתָא הֲווֹ  מִי לָא כְּתִיב וַיִּישַׁר הַדָּבָר בְּעֵינֵי אַבְשָׁלֹם (וְהַזְּקֵנִים) [וּבְעֵינֵי כׇּל זִקְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל] וְאָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף סָבֵי דְּבַהֲתָא
human_translation: Perhaps idol worship. not enter your mind, as it is written “And all the elders and all the people said to him: Do not consent and heed not” But perhaps they were wicked elders, Isn’t it written: “And the saying pleased Absalom well and all the elders of Israel” and Rav Yosef says: wicked elders.
llm_translation: Perhaps the foreign service did not come up with your opinion, as it is written, "And all the elders and all the people do not desire and do not listen." And perhaps the elders were in that place, as it is not written, "And the matter was right in the eyes of Absalom (and the elders) and in the eyes of all the elders of Israel." And Rav Yosef said, perhaps the elders were in that place.

hebrew_text: הָתָם לָא כְּתִיב וְכׇל הָעָם הָכָא כְּתִיב וְכׇל הָעָם דְּאִי אֶפְשָׁר דְּלָא הֲווֹ בְּהוֹן צַדִּיקֵי  וּכְתִיב וְהִשְׁאַרְתִּי בְיִשְׂרָאֵל שִׁבְעַת אֲלָפִים כׇּל הַבִּרְכַּיִם אֲשֶׁר לֹא כָרְעוּ לַבַּעַל וְכׇל הַפֶּה אֲשֶׁר לֹא נָשַׁק לוֹ
human_translation: There, it is not written: “And all the people,” here, it is written: “And all the people.” As it is impossible that there were not among them righteous And it is written: “And I will leave seven thousand in Israel; all the knees that have not bent to the Baal, and every mouth that has not kissed it”
llm_translation: There, it is not written "and all the people," here it is written "and all the people," for it is possible that there were no righteous among them. And it is written, "And I will leave in Israel seven thousand, all the knees that have not bowed to Baal, and every mouth that has not kissed him."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אַחְאָב שָׁקוּל הָיָה שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וַיֹּאמֶר ה' מִי יְפַתֶּה אֶת אַחְאָב וְיַעַל וְיִפֹּל בְּרָמֹת גִּלְעָד וַיֹּאמֶר זֶה בְּכֹה וְזֶה אֹמֵר בְּכֹה מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַבִּי יוֹסֵף מַאן דִּכְתִיב בֵּיהּ רַק לֹא הָיָה כְאַחְאָב אֲשֶׁר הִתְמַכֵּר לַעֲשׂוֹת הָרַע בְּעֵינֵי ה' אֲשֶׁר הֵסַתָּה אֹתוֹ אִיזֶבֶל אִשְׁתּוֹ וּתְנֵינָא בְּכׇל יוֹם הָיְתָה שׁוֹקֶלֶת שִׁקְלֵי זָהָב לַעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה וְאַתְּ אָמְרַתְּ שָׁקוּל הָיָה אֶלָּא אַחְאָב וַותְּרָן בְּמָמוֹנוֹ הָיָה וּמִתּוֹךְ שֶׁהֶהֱנָה תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים מִנְּכָסָיו כִּיפְּרוּ לוֹ מֶחֱצָה
human_translation: Rav Naḥman says: Ahab was balanced as it is stated: “And the Lord said, who shall entice Ahab that he may ascend and fall at Ramoth Gilead? And this one said in this manner, and that one said in that manner” Rav Yosef objects to this about whom wrote: “But there was none like Ahab who devoted himself to do evil in the eyes of the Lord, whom Jezebel his wife had incited” And we learn Every day she would weigh gold shekels for idol worship. And you say he was balanced? Rather, Ahab was generous with his money and since he benefited Torah scholars with his property, expiated half for him.
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said: Ahab was light in weight, as it is stated, "And the Lord said, 'Who will entice Ahab, that he may go up and fall at Ramoth-gilead?' And one said this thing, and another said that thing." Rabbi Yosef strongly objected to this: Who is it written about that there was none like Ahab, who sold himself to do evil in the eyes of the Lord, whom Jezebel his wife incited? And it is taught: Every day she would weigh out gold coins for idol worship. And you say he was light in weight? Rather, Ahab had leftover money, and because he supported Torah scholars from his possessions, they atoned for him half.

hebrew_text: וַיֵּצֵא הָרוּחַ וַיַּעֲמֹד לִפְנֵי ה' וַיֹּאמֶר אֲנִי אֲפַתֶּנּוּ וַיֹּאמֶר ה' אֵלָיו בַּמָּה וַיֹּאמֶר אֵצֵא וְהָיִיתִי רוּחַ שֶׁקֶר בְּפִי כׇּל נְבִיאָיו וַיֹּאמֶר תְּפַתֶּה וְגַם תּוּכָל צֵא וַעֲשֵׂה כֵן מַאי רוּחַ אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן רוּחוֹ שֶׁל נָבוֹת הַיִּזְרְעֵאלִי
human_translation: “And there came forth a spirit, and stood before the Lord, and said: I will entice him. And the Lord said to him: With what? And he said: I will go out, and I will be a lying spirit in the mouth of all his prophets. And He said: You shall entice him, and also prevail; go out, and do so” What spirit Rabbi Yoḥanan says: the spirit of Naboth the Jezreelite,
llm_translation: And the spirit went out and stood before the Lord, and he said, "I will entice him." And the Lord said to him, "With what?" And he said, "I will go out and be a lying spirit in the mouth of all his prophets." And He said, "You will entice and also prevail. Go out and do so." What is the spirit? Rabbi Yochanan said: The spirit of the prophets of the Yizre'eli.

hebrew_text: מַאי צֵא אָמַר רָבִינָא צֵא מִמְּחִיצָתִי שֶׁכֵּן כְּתִיב דֹּבֵר שְׁקָרִים לֹא יִכּוֹן לְנֶגֶד עֵינָי אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא הַיְינוּ דְּאָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי דְּפָרַע קִינֵּיהּ  מַחְרֵיב בֵּיתֵיהּ
human_translation: What “go out” Ravina says Go out from my partition as so it is written: “He that speaks falsehoods shall not be established before My eyes” Rav Pappa says this that people say: One who avenges his zealotry destroys his house.
llm_translation: "What is the meaning of 'Go out'? Rabinah said: Go out from my partition, for thus it is written, 'One who speaks lies shall not be established before My eyes.' Rav Pappa said: This is what people say, 'One who is like Pharaoh, his end will be destruction of his household.'"

hebrew_text: וַיַּעַשׂ אַחְאָב אֶת הָאֲשֵׁרָה וַיּוֹסֶף אַחְאָב לַעֲשׂוֹת לְהַכְעִיס אֶת ה' אֱלֹהֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל מִכֹּל מַלְכֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל אֲשֶׁר הָיוּ לְפָנָיו אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן שֶׁכָּתַב עַל דַּלְתוֹת שֹׁמְרוֹן אַחְאָב כָּפַר בֵּאלֹהֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל לְפִיכָךְ אֵין לוֹ חֵלֶק בֵּאלֹהֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל
human_translation: “And Ahab made the ashera ; and Ahab did more to provoke the Lord, God of Israel, to anger than all the kings of Israel that were before him” Rabbi Yoḥanan says: that he wrote on the doors of Samaria: Ahab denies the God of Israel, therefore he has no share in the God of Israel.
llm_translation: And Ahab made the Asherah, and Ahab added to provoke the Lord, the God of Israel, more than all the kings of Israel who were before him. Rabbi Yochanan said: Ahab wrote on the doors of Samaria, "Ahab denied the God of Israel, therefore he has no portion in the God of Israel."

hebrew_text: וַיְבַקֵּשׁ אֶת אֲחַזְיָהוּ וַיִּלְכְּדֻהוּ וְהוּא מִתְחַבֵּא בְשֹׁמְרוֹן אָמַר רַבִּי לֵוִי  שֶׁהָיָה קוֹדֵר אַזְכָּרוֹת וְכוֹתֵב עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה תַּחְתֵּיהֶן
human_translation: “And he sought Ahaziah, and they apprehended him, for he was hiding in Samaria” Rabbi Levi says: He would excise mentions and write idol worship in their stead.
llm_translation: And he sought Ahaziah, and they captured him while he was hiding in Samaria. Rabbi Levi said: He was blackening memories and writing foreign worship beneath them.

hebrew_text: מְנַשֶּׁה  שֶׁנָּשָׁה יָהּ דָּבָר אַחֵר מְנַשֶּׁה  שֶׁהִנְשִׁי אֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל לַאֲבִיהֶם שֶׁבַּשָּׁמַיִם וּמְנָלַן דְּלָא אָתֵי לְעָלְמָא דְּאָתֵי  דִּכְתִיב בֶּן שְׁתֵּים עֶשְׂרֵה שָׁנָה מְנַשֶּׁה בְמׇלְכוֹ וַחֲמִשִּׁים וְחָמֵשׁ שָׁנָה מָלַךְ בִּירוּשָׁלִָים וַיַּעַשׂ (הָרַע) [אֲשֵׁרָה] (בְּעֵינֵי ה') כַּאֲשֶׁר עָשָׂה אַחְאָב מֶלֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵל מָה אַחְאָב אֵין לוֹ חֵלֶק לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא  אַף מְנַשֶּׁה אֵין לוֹ חֵלֶק לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא
human_translation: Manasseh [ Menashe ] because he forgot God [ nasha yah ]. Alternatively, Manasseh since he caused the Israel to forget [ hinshi ] their Father Who is in Heaven. And from where do we that does not enter into the World-to-Come? as it is written: “Manasseh was twelve years old when he began to reign, and he reigned fifty-five years in Jerusalem… And he made an ashera , as did Ahab king of Israel” Just as Ahab has no share in the World-to-Come, so too, Manasseh has no share in the World-to-Come.
llm_translation: Manasseh, who made another thing, Manasseh, who caused Israel to sin before their Father in Heaven. And from where do we know that he does not come to the World to Come? As it is written, "Manasseh was twelve years old when he began to reign, and he reigned fifty-five years in Jerusalem. And he did evil in the eyes of the Lord, like the abominations of the nations whom the Lord had cast out before the children of Israel." Just as Ahab, king of Israel, what does Ahab have no portion in the World to Come, so too Manasseh has no portion in the World to Come.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר מְנַשֶּׁה יֵשׁ לוֹ חֵלֶק לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר 'וַיִּתְפַּלֵּל מְנַשֶּׁה אֶל ה' וַיֵּעָתֶר לוֹ' וְגוֹ' אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן וּשְׁנֵיהֶם מִקְרָא אֶחָד דָּרְשׁוּ שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וּנְתַתִּים לְזַעֲוָה לְכֹל מַמְלְכוֹת הָאָרֶץ בִּגְלַל מְנַשֶּׁה בֶן יְחִזְקִיָּהוּ מָר סָבַר בִּגְלַל מְנַשֶּׁה שֶׁעָשָׂה תְּשׁוּבָה וְאִינְהוּ לָא עֲבוּד וּמָר סָבַר
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: Manasseh has a share in the World-to-Come, as it is stated: “And he prayed to him and He was entreated of him, Rabbi Yoḥanan says: And both of them, interpreted one verse, as it is stated: “And I will make them into a horror for all the kingdoms of the earth, on account of Manasseh, son of Hezekiah” Sage, holds “on account of Manasseh” as repented, and they did not do And Sage, holds
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehudah says: Manasseh has a portion in the World to Come, as it is stated, "And Manasseh prayed to the Lord, and He was entreated by him" (2 Chronicles 33:13). Rabbi Yochanan said: Both of them expounded one verse, as it is stated, "And I will give them for a trembling, to all the kingdoms of the earth, because of Manasseh, the son of Hezekiah" (Jeremiah 15:4). One Master holds that it is because of Manasseh who repented, and the other Master holds that it is not because of Manasseh who repented.

hebrew_text: בִּגְלַל מְנַשֶּׁה  דְּלָא עֲבַד תְּשׁוּבָה
human_translation: “on account of Manasseh” because he did not repent,
llm_translation: Because of Menashe who did not repent.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן כׇּל הָאוֹמֵר מְנַשֶּׁה אֵין לוֹ חֵלֶק לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא מְרַפֶּה יְדֵיהֶן שֶׁל בַּעֲלֵי תְשׁוּבָה דְּתָנֵי תַּנָּא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מְנַשֶּׁה עָשָׂה תְּשׁוּבָה (לִשְׁלֹשִׁים) [שְׁלֹשִׁים] וְשָׁלֹשׁ שָׁנִים דִּכְתִיב בֵּן שְׁתֵּים עֶשְׂרֵה שָׁנָה מְנַשֶּׁה בְמׇלְכוֹ וַחֲמִשִּׁים וְחָמֵשׁ שָׁנָה מָלַךְ בִּירוּשָׁלִָים וַיַּעַשׂ (הָרַע) [אֲשֵׁרָה] וְכוּ' כַּאֲשֶׁר עָשָׂה אַחְאָב מֶלֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵל כַּמָּה מָלַךְ אַחְאָב  עֶשְׂרִין וְתַרְתֵּין שְׁנִין מְנַשֶּׁה כַּמָּה מָלַךְ  חֲמִשִּׁים וְחָמֵשׁ דַּל מִינַּיְיהוּ עֶשְׂרִים וְתַרְתֵּין פָּשׁוּ לְהוּ תְּלָתִין וּתְלָת
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Anyone who says Manasseh has no share in the World-to-Come discourages penitents, As tanna taught before Rabbi Yoḥanan: Manasseh repented for thirty-three years, as it is written: “Manasseh was twelve years old when he began to reign, and he reigned fifty-five years in Jerusalem…And he did that which was evil…And he made an ashera , as did Ahab king of Israel” How many did Ahab reign? twenty-two years. How many did Manasseh reign? fifty-five Deduct from them twenty-two thirty-three remain for him
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: Anyone who says that Menashe has no share in the World to Come weakens the hands of those who repent. For a Tanna taught before Rabbi Yochanan: Menashe repented for thirty-three years, as it is written, "He was twelve years old when he became king, and he reigned for fifty-five years in Jerusalem. And he did evil in the sight of the Lord, following the abominations of the nations that the Lord had dispossessed before the Israelites" (2 Kings 21:1-2). How long did Ahab reign? Twenty-two years. Menashe, how long did he reign? Fifty-five years. Subtract twenty-two from fifty-five, and you are left with thirty-three.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַי מַאי דִּכְתִיב וַיִּשְׁמַע אֵלָיו וַיֵּחָתֶר לוֹ וַיֵּעָתֶר לוֹ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ מְלַמֵּד שֶׁעָשָׂה לוֹ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא כְּמִין מַחְתֶּרֶת בָּרָקִיעַ כְּדֵי לְקַבְּלוֹ בִּתְשׁוּבָה מִפְּנֵי מִדַּת הַדִּין
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai: What which is written: “And he prayed to Him; and He made an opening for him” And He received his entreaty, should have been teaches that the Holy One, Blessed be He, crafted for him a type of opening in Heaven in order to accept him in repentance. due to the attribute of justice
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai: What is the meaning of what is written, "And He listened to him, and He dug for him, and He sought his favor"? It teaches that the Holy One, blessed be He, made for him a sort of tunnel in the firmament in order to receive his repentance, due to the attribute of strict justice.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַי מַאי דִּכְתִיב בְּרֵאשִׁית מַמְלֶכֶת יְהוֹיָקִים בֶּן יֹאשִׁיָּהוּ וּכְתִיב בְּרֵאשִׁית מַמְלֶכֶת צִדְקִיָּה וְכִי עַד הָאִידָּנָא לָא הֲווֹ מַלְכֵי
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan says in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai: What which is written: “In the beginning of the reign of Jehoiakim, son of Josiah” and it is written: “In the beginning of the reign of Zedekiah” But is it so until now there were no kings?
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yochanan said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai: What is the meaning of what is written, "In the beginning of the reign of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah" (2 Kings 23:34), and it is also written, "In the beginning of the reign of Zedekiah" (2 Kings 24:18)? Were there not kings until now?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא בִּקֵּשׁ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לְהַחְזִיר אֶת הָעוֹלָם כּוּלּוֹ לְתוֹהוּ וָבוֹהוּ בִּשְׁבִיל יְהוֹיָקִים נִסְתַּכֵּל בְּדוֹרוֹ וְנִתְקָרְרָה דַּעְתּוֹ
human_translation: Rather, the Holy One, Blessed be He, sought to restore the entire world to chaos and void, on account of Jehoiakim He observed generation, and His mind was set at ease.
llm_translation: Instead, the Holy One, blessed be He, sought to return the entire world to chaos and void for the sake of Jehoiakim. He looked at his generation and his mind was put at ease.

hebrew_text: בִּקֵּשׁ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לְהַחְזִיר אֶת הָעוֹלָם כּוּלּוֹ לְתוֹהוּ וָבוֹהוּ בִּשְׁבִיל דּוֹרוֹ שֶׁל צִדְקִיָּה נִסְתַּכֵּל בְּצִדְקִיָּה וְנִתְקָרְרָה דַּעְתּוֹ בְּצִדְקִיָּה נָמֵי כְּתִיב וַיַּעַשׂ הָרַע בְּעֵינֵי ה' שֶׁהָיָה בְּיָדוֹ לִמְחוֹת וְלֹא מִיחָה
human_translation: the Holy One, Blessed be He, sought to restore the entire world to chaos and void, on account of the generation of Zedekiah, He observed Zedekiah and His mind was set at ease. With regard to Zedekiah it is also written: “And he did evil in the eyes of the Lord” he had in his power to rebuke and he did not rebuke
llm_translation: The Holy One, blessed be He, sought to return the entire world to desolation and void for the sake of the generation of Zedekiah. He looked at Zedekiah, and his mind was appeased by Zedekiah. It is also written: "And he did what was evil in the eyes of the Lord, as it was in his power to erase and he did not erase."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַי מַאי דִּכְתִיב אִישׁ חָכָם נִשְׁפָּט אֶת אִישׁ אֱוִיל וְרָגַז וְשָׂחַק וְאֵין נָחַת  אָמַר הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא כָּעַסְתִּי עַל אָחָז וּנְתַתִּיו בְּיַד מַלְכֵי דַמֶּשֶׂק זִיבַּח וְקִיטֵּר [לֵאלֹהֵיהֶם] שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר 'וַיִּזְבַּח לֵאלֹהֵי דַרְמֶשֶׂק הַמַּכִּים בּוֹ וַיֹּאמֶר [כִּי] אֱלֹהֵי מַלְכֵי אֲרָם הֵם מַעְזְרִים אוֹתָם לָהֶם אֲזַבֵּחַ וְיַעְזְרוּנִי וְהֵם הָיוּ [לוֹ] לְהַכְשִׁילוֹ וּלְכׇל יִשְׂרָאֵל'
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan says in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai: What which is written: “If a wise man contends with a foolish man, whether he is angry or laughs, there is no rest” The Holy One, Blessed be He, said: I was angry with Ahaz and I delivered him into the hand of the kings of Damascus. He sacrificed and burned to their gods, as it is stated: “He sacrificed to the gods of Damascus that smote him; and he said: Because the gods of the kings of Aram help them, I will sacrifice to them, and they will help me. But they were the ruin of him, and of all Israel”
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yochanan said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai: What is the meaning of what is written, "A wise man judges a fool, and he is angry and laughs, yet there is no pleasure"? The Holy One, blessed be He, said: I was angry with Ahaz and I delivered him into the hands of the kings of Damascus, and he sacrificed and burned incense to their gods, as it is said, "And he sacrificed to the gods of Damascus who struck him, and he said, 'Because the gods of the kings of Aram help them, I will sacrifice to them so that they may help me,' but they were his downfall and the downfall of all Israel."

hebrew_text: שָׂחַקְתִּי עִם אֲמַצְיָה וְנָתַתִּי מַלְכֵי אֱדוֹם בְּיָדוֹ הֵבִיא אֱלֹהֵיהֶם וְהִשְׁתַּחֲוָה לָהֶם שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר 'וַיְהִי אַחֲרֵי בוֹא אֲמַצְיָהוּ מֵהַכּוֹת אֶת אֲדוֹמִים וַיָּבֵא אֶת אֱלֹהֵי בְּנֵי שֵׂעִיר וַיַּעֲמִידֵם [לוֹ] לֵאלֹהִים וְלִפְנֵיהֶם יִשְׁתַּחֲוֶה וְלָהֶם יְקַטֵּר' אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא הַיְינוּ דְּאָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי בְּכַיי לֵיהּ לְמָר (דְּלָא) [וְלָא] יָדַע חֲיַיכִי לְמָר (דְּלָא) [וְלָא] יָדַע וַוי לֵיהּ לְמָר דְּלָא יָדַע בֵּין טָב לְבִישׁ
human_translation: I smiled upon Amaziah and I delivered the kings of Edom into his hand. he brought their gods and bowed to them, as it is stated: “And it came to pass after Amaziah came from striking the Edomites, that he brought the gods of the children of Seir and set them up to be his gods and prostrated himself before them, and burned incense to them” Rav Pappa says this that people say: I cried for the master and he did not know, I smiled for the master and he did not know; woe unto the master who does not know between good and bad.
llm_translation: I laughed with Amaziah and I will give the kings of Edom into his hand. He brought their gods and bowed down to them, as it is said, "And it came to pass, after Amaziah was come from the slaughter of the Edomites, that he brought the gods of the children of Seir, and set them up to be his gods, and bowed down himself before them, and burned incense unto them." Rav Papa said: This is what people say, "Let him cry to his master who does not know how to distinguish between good and bad."

hebrew_text: וַיָּבֹאוּ כֹּל [שָׂרֵי] מֶלֶךְ בָּבֶל ( וַיָּבֹאוּ) [ וַיֵּשְׁבוּ] בְּשַׁעַר הַתָּוֶךְ אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַי מָקוֹם שֶׁמְּחַתְּכִין בּוֹ הֲלָכוֹת  אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא הַיְינוּ דְּאָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי בְּאַתְרָא דְּמָרֵיהּ תְּלָא לֵיהּ זְיָינֵיהּ תַּמָּן קוּלְבָּא רָעֲיָא קוּלְּתֵיהּ תְּלָא
human_translation: “And all the princes of the king of Babylonia came in and sat in the middle gate [ sha’ar hattavekh ]” Rabbi Yoḥanan said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai: the place in which they decide [ meḥattekhin ] halakhot . Rav Pappa says this that people say: In the place that the master hangs his weapons, there the despicable shepherd hangs his jug.
llm_translation: And all the princes of the king of Babylon came and sat in the middle gate. Rabbi Yochanan said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai: The place where Halakhot are decided. Rav Pappa said: This is what people say in the place of their master, his dog is hanging there, his bread is there, his jug is hanging there.

hebrew_text: סִימַן עַל שְׂדֵה (בָתִּים) [כִּתִּים] לֹא תְּאוּנֶּה
human_translation: a mnemonic By the field, houses, shall not befall.
llm_translation: Sign on a field (houses) kilns not will be built

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה בַּר אַבָּא מַאי דִּכְתִיב עַל שְׂדֵה אִישׁ עָצֵל עָבַרְתִּי וְעַל כֶּרֶם אָדָם חֲסַר לֵב וְהִנֵּה עָלָה כֻלּוֹ קִמְּשׂוֹנִים כׇּסּוּ פָנָיו חֲרֻלִּים וְגֶדֶר אֲבָנָיו נֶהֱרָסָה עַל שְׂדֵה אִישׁ עָצֵל עָבַרְתִּי זֶה אָחָז וְעַל כֶּרֶם אָדָם חֲסַר לֵב זֶה מְנַשֶּׁה וְהִנֵּה עָלָה כֻלּוֹ קִמְּשׂוֹנִים זֶה אָמוֹן כׇּסּוּ פָנָיו חֲרֻלִּים זֶה יְהוֹיָקִים וְגֶדֶר אֲבָנָיו נֶהֱרָסָה זֶה צִדְקִיָּהוּ שֶׁנֶּחְרַב בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ בְּיָמָיו
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda says Rabbi Yirmeya bar Abba says: What which is written: “I passed by the field of an indolent man, and by the vineyard of a man void of understanding; and behold, it was overgrown with thistles, and its surface was covered with nettles, and its stone wall was broken” “I passed by the field of an indolent man”; this Ahaz. “And by the vineyard of a man void of understanding”; this Manasseh. “And behold, it was overgrown with thistles”; this Amon. “And its surface was covered with nettles”; this Jehoiakim. “And its stone wall was broken”; this Zedekiah, in whose days the Temple was destroyed.
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisdah said, Rabbi Yirmeya bar Abba said: What is the meaning of what is written, "I passed by the field of a lazy person, and by the vineyard of a person lacking heart, and behold, it was all overgrown with thorns, its surface was covered with nettles, and its stone wall was broken down"? (Proverbs 24:30-31) "I passed by the field of a lazy person" - this refers to Ahaz. "And by the vineyard of a person lacking heart" - this refers to Menashe. "And behold, it was all overgrown with thorns" - this refers to Amon. "Its surface was covered with nettles" - this refers to Yehoyakim. "And its stone wall was broken down" - this refers to Tzidkiyahu, whose Temple was destroyed in his days.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה בַּר אַבָּא אַרְבַּע כִּיתּוֹת אֵין מְקַבְּלוֹת פְּנֵי שְׁכִינָה כַּת לֵצִים כַּת שַׁקְרָנִים כַּת חֲנֵיפִים כַּת מְסַפְּרֵי לָשׁוֹן הָרָע כַּת לֵצִים דִּכְתִיב מָשַׁךְ יָדוֹ אֶת לֹצְצִים כַּת שַׁקְרָנִים דִּכְתִיב דֹּבֵר שְׁקָרִים לֹא יִכּוֹן לְנֶגֶד עֵינָי כַּת חֲנֵיפִים דִּכְתִיב כִּי לֹא לְפָנָיו חָנֵף יָבוֹא כַּת מְסַפְּרֵי לָשׁוֹן הָרָע דִּכְתִיב כִּי לֹא אֵל חָפֵץ רֶשַׁע אָתָּה לֹא יְגֻרְךָ רָע צַדִּיק אַתָּה וְלֹא יִהְיֶה בִּמְגוּרְךָ רָע
human_translation: And Rav Ḥisda says Rabbi Yirmeya bar Abba says four groups do not receive the Divine Presence: the group of cynics, the group of liars, the group of flatterers, the group of slanderers. the group of cynics, as it is written: “He withdrew His hand with cynics” the group of liars, as it is written: “He that speaks falsehoods shall not be established before My eyes” the group of flatterers, as it is written: “That a flatterer shall not come before Him” the group of slanderers, as it is stated: “For You are not a God who desires wickedness; evil shall not dwell with You” You are righteous, and there will be no evil in Your dwelling.
llm_translation: And Rav Hisda said, Rabbi Yirmeya bar Abba said: Four types do not receive the presence of the Divine Presence: scoffers, liars, hypocrites, and those who speak lashon hara. Scoffers, as it is written, "He draws his hand against scoffers." Liars, as it is written, "A false speaker will not be established before My eyes." Hypocrites, as it is written, "For no wicked person will come before Him." And those who speak lashon hara, as it is written, "For You are not a God who desires wickedness; evil does not dwell with You. The boastful shall not stand before Your eyes; You hate all evildoers."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה בַּר אַבָּא מַאי דִּכְתִיב לֹא תְאֻנֶּה אֵלֶיךָ רָעָה וְנֶגַע לֹא יִקְרַב בְּאׇהֳלֶךָ לֹא תְאֻנֶּה אֵלֶיךָ רָעָה  שֶׁלֹּא יִשְׁלוֹט בָּהֶן יֵצֶר הָרָע וְנֶגַע לֹא יִקְרַב בְּאׇהֳלֶךָ  שֶׁלֹּא תִּמְצָא אִשְׁתְּךָ סְפֵק נִדָּה בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁתָּבֹא מִן הַדֶּרֶךְ
human_translation: And Rav Ḥisda says Rabbi Yirmeya bar Abba says: What which is written: “No evil shall befall you, nor shall any plague come near your tent” “No evil shall befall you” that the evil inclination shall not dominate them. “Nor shall any plague come near your tent” that you will never find your wife uncertainty a menstruating woman when you return from a journey.
llm_translation: And Rav Ḥisda said, Rabbi Yirmeya bar Abba said: What is the meaning of what is written, "No evil will befall you, and no affliction will come near your tent"? "No evil will befall you" - that the evil inclination should not have dominion over them, and "no affliction will come near your tent" - that you should not find your wife in a state of doubt regarding menstruation when you return from the road.

hebrew_text: דָּבָר אַחֵר לֹא תְאֻנֶּה אֵלֶיךָ רָעָה  שֶׁלֹּא יְבַעֲתוּךְ חֲלוֹמוֹת רָעִים וְהִרְהוּרִים רָעִים וְנֶגַע לֹא יִקְרַב בְּאׇהֳלֶךָ  שֶׁלֹּא יְהֵא לְךָ בֵּן אוֹ תַּלְמִיד שֶׁמַּקְדִּיחַ תַּבְשִׁילוֹ בָּרַבִּים כְּגוֹן יֵשׁוּ הַנּוֹצְרִי
human_translation: Alternatively, “no evil shall befall you” that you will be frightened neither by bad dreams nor by evil thoughts. “Nor shall any plague come near your tent” that you will not have a child or student who overcooks his food in public, such as Jesus the Nazarene.
llm_translation: Another matter: Do not bring upon yourself evil, so that bad dreams and evil thoughts will not disturb you, and a plague will not come near your tent, so that you will not have a son or a student who spoils his food in public, like Yeshu the Nazarene.

hebrew_text: עַד כָּאן בֵּרְכוֹ אָבִיו מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ בֵּרְכַתּוּ אִמּוֹ כִּי מַלְאָכָיו יְצַוֶּה לָּךְ לִשְׁמׇרְךָ בְּכׇל דְּרָכֶיךָ עַל כַּפַּיִם יִשָּׂאוּנְךָ וְגוֹ' עַל שַׁחַל וָפֶתֶן תִּדְרֹךְ וְגוֹ'
human_translation: Until this point father, blessed him, From this forward, his mother blessed him, “For he shall order His angels to preserve you in all your ways. They shall bear you on their hands, You shall tread upon the lion and the adder;
llm_translation: Until here his father blessed him, from here and onwards his mother blesses him, for His angels He will command for you, to guard you in all your ways. On their hands they will lift you up, etc. You will tread upon lion and adder, etc.

hebrew_text: עַד כָּאן בֵּרְכַתּוּ אִמּוֹ מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ בֵּרְכַתּוּ שָׁמַיִם
human_translation: Until this point his mother blessed him. From this forward, Heaven blessed him,
llm_translation: Until here his mother's blessing, from here onwards the blessing is from Heaven.

hebrew_text: כִּי בִי חָשַׁק וַאֲפַלְּטֵהוּ אֲשַׂגְּבֵהוּ כִּי יָדַע שְׁמִי יִקְרָאֵנִי וְאֶעֱנֵהוּ עִמּוֹ אָנֹכִי בְצָרָה אֲחַלְּצֵהוּ וַאֲכַבְּדֵהוּ אוֹרֶךְ יָמִים אַשְׂבִּיעֵהוּ וְאַרְאֵהוּ בִּישׁוּעָתִי
human_translation: “Because he has desired Me, therefore I will deliver him; I will set him on high, because he has known My name. He shall call upon Me, and I will answer him; I will be with him in trouble; I will deliver him, and honor him. With long life I will satisfy him, and show him My salvation”
llm_translation: When he desires Me, I will deliver him; I will exalt him, for he knows My name. He will call upon Me, and I will answer him; I am with him in distress. I will rescue him and honor him. With long life, I will satisfy him, and show him My salvation.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ מַאי דִּכְתִיב וְיִמָּנַע מֵרְשָׁעִים אוֹרָם וּזְרוֹעַ רָמָה תִּשָּׁבֵר  מִפְּנֵי מָה עַיִן שֶׁל רְשָׁעִים תְּלוּיָה  כֵּיוָן שֶׁנַּעֲשֶׂה אָדָם רָשׁ מִלְּמַטָּה  נַעֲשֶׂה רָשׁ מִלְּמַעְלָה
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish says: What which is written: “And He will withhold their light from the wicked [ resha’im ], and the high arm shall be broken” For what ayin of resha’im suspended Once a person becomes poor below he becomes poor above,
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: What is the meaning of what is written, "And let the light of the wicked be put out, and the flame of his fire not shine"? For what reason is the eye of the wicked dependent? Once a person becomes wicked from below, he becomes wicked from above.

hebrew_text: וְלָא נִכְתְּבַיהּ כְּלָל רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר חַד אָמַר מִפְּנֵי כְּבוֹדוֹ שֶׁל דָּוִד וְחַד אָמַר מִשּׁוּם כְּבוֹדוֹ שֶׁל נְחֶמְיָה בֶּן חֲכַלְיָה
human_translation: let not be written at all Rabbi Yoḥanan and Rabbi Elazar One says: due to the honor of David, And one says: due to the honor of Nehemiah, son of Hacaliah,
llm_translation: And not written at all Rabbi Yochanan and Rabbi Elazar, one said because of the honor of David, and one said because of the honor of Nehemiah son of Hachaliah.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן מְנַשֶּׁה הָיָה שׁוֹנֶה חֲמִשִּׁים וַחֲמִשָּׁה פָּנִים בְּתוֹרַת כֹּהֲנִים כְּנֶגֶד שְׁנֵי מַלְכוּתוֹ אַחְאָב שְׁמֹנִים וַחֲמִשָּׁה יָרׇבְעָם מֵאָה וּשְׁלֹשָׁה
human_translation: The Sages taught Manasseh, would study fifty-five aspects in Torat Kohanim , corresponding to the years of his reign, Ahab eighty-five Jeroboam one hundred and three
llm_translation: The sages taught: Menasheh would review fifty-five faces in the Torah of the priests, corresponding to the two kingdoms of Ahab, eighty-five, and Jeroboam, one hundred and three.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא הָיָה רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר אַבְשָׁלוֹם אֵין לוֹ חֵלֶק לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר 'וַיַּכּוּ אֶת אַבְשָׁלוֹם וַיְמִיתֻהוּ' 'וַיַּכּוּהוּ'  בְּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה 'וַיְמִיתֻהוּ'  לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא תַּנְיָא רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי מֵאִיר אָחָז וַאֲחַזְיָה וְכׇל מַלְכֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁכָּתוּב בָּהֶן 'וַיַּעַשׂ הָרָע בְּעֵינֵי ה''  לֹא חַיִּין וְלֹא נִידּוֹנִין
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Meir would say: Absalom has no share in the World-to-Come, as it is stated: “And they smote Absalom and they killed him” “And they smote in this world, “and they killed him” in the World-to-Come. It is taught Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says in the name of Rabbi Meir: Ahaz and Ahaziah, and all of the kings of Israel about whom it is written: “And he did evil in the eyes of the Lord” neither live nor are sentenced
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Meir said, "Absalom has no share in the World to Come, as it is stated, 'And they struck Absalom and killed him.' 'And they struck him' - in this world; 'and killed him' - in the World to Come." It was taught: Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar said in the name of Rabbi Meir, "Achaz, Achazyahu, and all the kings of Israel concerning whom it is written, 'And he did evil in the eyes of the Lord,' are neither alive nor judged."

hebrew_text: וְגַם דָּם נָקִי שָׁפַךְ מְנַשֶּׁה הַרְבֵּה מְאֹד עַד אֲשֶׁר מִלֵּא אֶת יְרוּשָׁלִַים פֶּה לָפֶה לְבַד מֵחַטָּאתוֹ אֲשֶׁר הֶחֱטִיא אֶת יְהוּדָה לַעֲשׂוֹת הָרַע בְּעֵינֵי ה' הָכָא תַּרְגִּימוּ שֶׁהָרַג יְשַׁעְיָה בְּמַעְרְבָא אָמְרִי שֶׁעָשָׂה צֶלֶם מַשּׂאוֹי אֶלֶף בְּנֵי אָדָם וּבְכׇל יוֹם וָיוֹם הוֹרֵג (אֶת) כּוּלָּם כְּמַאן אָזְלָא הָא דְּאָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה שְׁקוּלָה נְשָׁמָה שֶׁל צַדִּיק אֶחָד כְּנֶגֶד כׇּל הָעוֹלָם כּוּלּוֹ  כְּמַאן דְּאָמַר יְשַׁעְיָה הָרַג
human_translation: “And Manasseh shed a great deal of innocent blood, until he filled Jerusalem from one end to another [ peh lafeh ], beside his sin that he made Judea sin, to do evil in the eyes of the Lord” Here, they interpret that he killed Isaiah In the West, they say that crafted an idol a burden one thousand people and each and every day he kill all of them. In accordance with whose is that which Rabba bar bar Ḥana says: The soul of one righteous person is equal to the entire world? in accordance with the one who says: He killed Isaiah.
llm_translation: And also innocent blood Menashe spilled very much until he filled Jerusalem mouth to mouth alone from his sin that he caused Judah to do evil in the eyes of Hashem. Here they interpret that Yeshayahu was killed in Ma'arava. They say that he made an image of his idol and with it he killed a thousand people every day. Who is the one who went? This is what Rabbah bar bar Ḥana said: The soul of one righteous person is equivalent to the entire world. Who is the one who said that Yeshayahu was killed.

hebrew_text: כְּתִיב פֶּסֶל וּכְתִיב פְּסִילִים אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בַּתְּחִלָּה עָשָׂה לוֹ פַּרְצוּף אֶחָד וּלְבַסּוֹף עָשָׂה לוֹ אַרְבָּעָה פַּרְצוּפִים כְּדֵי שֶׁתִּרְאֶה שְׁכִינָה וְתִכְעוֹס
human_translation: It is written “an idol” and it is written “idols” Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Initially, he crafted one face [ partzuf ] for and ultimately, he crafted four faces for it so that the Divine Presence would see and become angry.
llm_translation: It is written "pesel" and it is written "pesilim." Rabbi Yochanan said: Initially, he made for it one face, and in the end, he made for it four faces, so that the Divine Presence may be seen and become angry.

hebrew_text: אָחָז הֶעֱמִידוֹ בַּעֲלִיָּיה שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וְאֵת הַמִּזְבְּחוֹת אֲשֶׁר עַל הַגָּג עֲלִיַּת אָחָז וְגוֹ' מְנַשֶּׁה הֶעֱמִידוֹ בַּהֵיכָל שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וַיָּשֶׂם אֶת פֶּסֶל הָאֲשֵׁרָה אֲשֶׁר עָשָׂה בַּבַּיִת אֲשֶׁר אָמַר ה' אֶל דָּוִד וְאֶל שְׁלֹמֹה [בְנוֹ] בַּבַּיִת הַזֶּה וּבִירוּשָׁלִַים אֲשֶׁר בָּחַרְתִּי מִכֹּל שִׁבְטֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל אָשִׂים אֶת שְׁמִי לְעוֹלָם אָמוֹן הִכְנִיסוֹ לְבֵית קׇדְשֵׁי הַקֳּדָשִׁים שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר כִּי קָצַר הַמַּצָּע מֵהִשְׂתָּרֵעַ וְהַמַּסֵּכָה צָרָה כְּהִתְכַּנֵּס
human_translation: Ahaz placed in the upper chamber as it is stated: “And the altars that were on the roof of the upper chamber of Ahaz” Manasseh placed it in the Sanctuary as it is stated: “And he set the graven image of the ashera that he had crafted, in that house of which the Lord said to David, and to Solomon his son: In this house, and in Jerusalem, which I have chosen from all the tribes of Israel, will I put My name forever” Amon introduced it into the Holy of Holies, as it is stated: “For the bed is too short for spreading, and the covering too narrow for when he gathers himself”
llm_translation: Ahaz established it in the upper chamber of his house, as it is stated: "And the altars that were on the roof of the upper chamber of Ahaz" (2 Kings 23:12). Manasseh established it in the Temple, as it is stated: "And he placed the idol of Asherah that he had made in the House, of which the Lord had said to David and to Solomon his son: 'In this House and in Jerusalem, which I have chosen out of all the tribes of Israel, I will establish My name forever'" (2 Kings 21:7). Ammon he brought into the Chamber of the Holy of Holies, as it is stated: "For the bed is shorter than that a man can stretch himself on it, and the covering narrower than that he can wrap himself in it" (Isaiah 28:20).

hebrew_text: מַאי כִּי קָצַר הַמַּצָּע מֵהִשְׂתָּרֵעַ אָמַר רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן [כִּי] קָצַר הַמַּצָּע זֶה מִלְּהִשְׂתָּרֵר עָלָיו שְׁנֵי רֵעִים כְּאֶחָד מַאי וְהַמַּסֵּכָה צָרָה וְגוֹ' אָמַר רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן כִּי הֲוָה מָטֵי לְהַאי קְרָא הֲוָה קָא בָכֵי מִי שֶׁכָּתַב בּוֹ 'כֹּנֵס כַּנֵּד מֵי הַיָּם' תֵּעָשֶׂה לוֹ מַסֵּכָה צָרָה
human_translation: What “For the bed is too short for spreading”? Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani says Rabbi Yonatan says For his bed is too narrow for two colleagues to spread upon it together, What “and the covering [ masekha ] too narrow [ tzara ] Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani says: When Rabbi Yonatan would reach this verse he would cry. He about whom it is written: “He gathers [ kones ] the waters of the sea like a rampart” shall a graven image [ masekha ] be a rival [ tzara ]?
llm_translation: What is the meaning of "when the mattress is too short from stretching out"? Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said in the name of Rabbi Yonatan: "When the mattress is too short, this refers to having two friends lie on it as one." What is the meaning of "and a covering is narrow"? Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said in the name of Rabbi Yonatan: "When he was coming to this verse, he was crying, for it is written in it, 'He gathers the waters of the sea together as a heap; he lays up the deeps in storehouses.' A narrow covering shall be made for him."

hebrew_text: [אָחָז בִּטֵּל אֶת הָעֲבוֹדָה] וְחָתַם אֶת הַתּוֹרָה שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר צוֹר תְּעוּדָה חֲתוֹם תּוֹרָה בְּלִמּוּדָי מְנַשֶּׁה קָדַר אֶת הָאַזְכָּרוֹת וְהָרַס אֶת הַמִּזְבֵּחַ אָמוֹן שָׂרַף אֶת הַתּוֹרָה וְהֶעֱלָה שְׂמָמִית עַל גַּבֵּי הַמִּזְבֵּחַ אָחָז הִתִּיר אֶת הָעֶרְוָה מְנַשֶּׁה בָּא עַל אֲחוֹתוֹ
human_translation: Ahaz nullified the service and sealed the Torah, as it is stated: “Bind up the testimony, seal the Torah among my disciples” Manasseh excised the mentions and destroyed the altar. Amon burned the Torah and sacrificed a gecko, upon the altar. Ahaz permitted forbidden relatives, Manasseh engaged in sexual intercourse with his sister.
llm_translation: He seized the service and sealed the Torah, as it is said, "Bind up the testimony, seal the Torah" (Isaiah 8:16).
