Menasheh Kadar erased the remembrances, and Ahaz burnt the Torah and offered desolation upon the altar. Ahaz permitted forbidden relationships, and Menasheh came upon his sister.

hebrew_text: אָמוֹן בָּא עַל אִמּוֹ שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר כִּי הוּא אָמוֹן הִרְבָּה אַשְׁמָה רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר חַד אָמַר שֶׁשָּׂרַף אֶת הַתּוֹרָה וְחַד אָמַר שֶׁבָּא עַל אִמּוֹ אָמְרָה לוֹ אִמּוֹ כְּלוּם יֵשׁ לְךָ הֲנָאָה מִמָּקוֹם שֶׁיָּצָאתָ מִמֶּנּוּ אָמַר לָהּ כְּלוּם אֲנִי עוֹשֶׂה אֶלָּא לְהַכְעִיס אֶת בּוֹרְאִי
human_translation: Amon engaged in sexual intercourse with his mother, as it is stated: “But Amon increased his guilt” Rabbi Yoḥanan and Rabbi Elazar one says that he burned the Torah, and one says that he engaged in sexual intercourse with his mother. His mother said to him: Do you have any pleasure from the place from which you emerged? He said to her: I am doing only to express insolence to my Creator,
llm_translation: A son came upon his mother, as it is stated, "For he came upon his mother" (Genesis 49:4). Rabbi Yochanan and Rabbi Elazar disagreed. One said that he burned the Torah, and one said that he came upon his mother. His mother said to him, "Do you have any benefit from the place from which you came out?" He said to her, "I do nothing but to provoke my Creator."

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא יְהוֹיָקִים אָמַר קַמָּאֵי לָא יָדְעִי לְאַרְגּוֹזֵי כְּלוּם אָנוּ צְרִיכִין אֶלָּא לְאוֹרוֹ יֵשׁ לָנוּ זְהַב פַּרְוַיִים שֶׁאָנוּ מִשְׁתַּמְּשִׁין בּוֹ יִטּוֹל אוֹרוֹ אָמְרוּ לוֹ וַהֲלֹא כֶּסֶף וְזָהָב שֶׁלּוֹ הוּא שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר 'לִי הַכֶּסֶף וְלִי הַזָּהָב נְאֻם ה' צְבָאוֹת' אָמַר לָהֶם כְּבָר נְתָנוֹ לָנוּ שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר 'הַשָּׁמַיִם שָׁמַיִם לַה' וְהָאָרֶץ נָתַן לִבְנֵי אָדָם'
human_translation: When Jehoiakim came he said: predecessors did not know to express insolence to Do we need even for his light? we have parvayim gold that we use let take His light They said to him: Aren’t the silver and the gold His, as it is stated: “The silver is mine and the gold is mine says the Lord of hosts” said to them: He has already given it to us, as it is stated: “The heavens are the heavens of the Lord, but the earth He has given to the children of men”
llm_translation: When Yehoyakim came, he said before them, "I do not know how to weave ropes; we only need his light. We have gold, fine pearls that we use. Let him take his light." They said to him, "But isn't the silver and gold his, as it is stated, 'Mine is the silver, and Mine is the gold,' says the Lord of hosts?" He said to them, "He has already given it to us, as it is stated, 'The heavens are the heavens of the Lord, but the earth He has given to the children of men.'"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא לְרַבָּה בַּר מָרִי מִפְּנֵי מָה לֹא מָנוּ אֶת יְהוֹיָקִים מִשּׁוּם דִּכְתִיב בֵּיהּ וְיֶתֶר דִּבְרֵי יְהוֹיָקִים וְתֹעֲבֹתָיו אֲשֶׁר עָשָׂה וְהַנִּמְצָא עָלָיו מַאי וְהַנִּמְצָא עָלָיו רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר חַד אָמַר שֶׁחָקַק שֵׁם עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה עַל אַמָּתוֹ וְחַד אָמַר שֶׁחָקַק שֵׁם שָׁמַיִם עַל אַמָּתוֹ
human_translation: Rava said to Rabba bar Mari: For what did not enumerate Jehoiakim because it is written concerning him: “And the rest of the acts of Jehoiakim and his abominations that he did, and that which was found on him” What “and that which was found on him”? Rabbi Yoḥanan and Rabbi Elazar one says that he etched the name of idols on his penis and one says that he etched the name of Heaven on his penis
llm_translation: Rava said to Rabba bar Mari: Why was Jehoiakim not counted? Because it is written about him, "And the rest of the acts of Jehoiakim, and his abominations which he did, and that which was found against him, what was found against him?" Rabbi Yochanan and Rabbi Elazar each said one thing: one said that he engraved the name of a foreign deity on his arm, and one said that he engraved the name of heaven on his arm.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ בִּמְלָכִים לֹא שָׁמַעְתִּי בְּהֶדְיוֹטוֹת שָׁמַעְתִּי מִפְּנֵי מָה לֹא מָנוּ אֶת מִיכָה  מִפְּנֵי שֶׁפִּתּוֹ מְצוּיָה לְעוֹבְרֵי דְּרָכִים שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר כׇּל הָעוֹבֵר וְשָׁב אֶל הַלְוִיִּם
human_translation: said to With regard to kings, I did not hear with regard to commoners, I heard For what did not enumerate Micah due to that his bread available for passersby, as it is stated: All those who pass by the Levites.
llm_translation: He said to him, "In matters of kings I have not heard, but in matters of commoners I have heard. Why did they not appoint Micah? Because his lip is found among those who transgress paths, as it is stated, 'Everyone who transgresses and returns to the Levites.'"

hebrew_text: וְעָבַר בַּיָּם צָרָה וְהִכָּה בַיָּם גַּלִּים אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן זֶה פִּסְלוֹ שֶׁל מִיכָה תַּנְיָא רַבִּי נָתָן אוֹמֵר מִגָּרֵב לְשִׁילֹה שְׁלֹשָׁה מִילִין וְהָיָה עֲשַׁן הַמַּעֲרָכָה וַעֲשַׁן פֶּסֶל מִיכָה מִתְעָרְבִין זֶה בָּזֶה
human_translation: “And He shall pass through the sea with affliction and shall strike the waves in the sea” Rabbi Yoḥanan says: This the idol of Micah, It is taught Rabbi Natan says: from Gerav, to Shiloh, was three mil , and the smoke from the arrangement and the smoke of the idol of Micah would intermingle with each other.
llm_translation: And he passed through the sea, distress, and struck the sea, waves. Rabbi Yochanan said: This is the idol of Micah. It was taught: Rabbi Natan says: From Gerav to Shiloh, three mil, and the smoke of the altar and the smoke of the idol of Micah intermingle with each other.

hebrew_text: בִּקְּשׁוּ מַלְאֲכֵי הַשָּׁרֵת לְדוֹחְפוֹ אָמַר לָהֶן הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא 'הַנִּיחוּ לוֹ שֶׁפִּתּוֹ מְצוּיָה לְעוֹבְרֵי דְּרָכִים' וְעַל דָּבָר זֶה נֶעְנְשׁוּ אַנְשֵׁי פִּלֶגֶשׁ בַּגִּבְעָה אָמַר לָהֶן הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא 'בִּכְבוֹדִי לֹא מְחִיתֶם עַל כְּבוֹדוֹ שֶׁל בָּשָׂר וָדָם מְחִיתֶם'
human_translation: The ministering angels sought to dismiss him The Holy One, Blessed be He, said to them: Leave him, as his bread is available for travelers. And it is for this matter, the people the concubine in Gibeah were punished. The Holy One, Blessed be He, said to them: You did not protest for My honor you protested for the honor of flesh and blood
llm_translation: The angels of service sought to push him, He said to them, the Holy One, blessed be He, "Leave him, for his lip is destined for those who study Torah." And regarding this matter, the men of Pilegesh were punished on the hill. He said to them, the Holy One, blessed be He, "You have not extinguished My honor for the honor of flesh and blood, you have extinguished."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בֶּן קִסְמָא גְּדוֹלָה לְגִימָה שֶׁהִרְחִיקָה שְׁתֵּי מִשְׁפָּחוֹת מִיִּשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר עַל דְּבַר אֲשֶׁר לֹא קִדְּמוּ אֶתְכֶם בַּלֶּחֶם וּבַמַּיִם וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן דִּידֵיהּ אָמַר מְרַחֶקֶת אֶת הַקְּרוֹבִים וּמְקָרֶבֶת אֶת הָרְחוֹקִים וּמַעֲלֶמֶת עֵינַיִם מִן הָרְשָׁעִים וּמַשְׁרָה שְׁכִינָה עַל נְבִיאֵי הַבַּעַל וְשִׁגְגָתוֹ עוֹלָה זָדוֹן
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says in the name of Rabbi Yosei ben Kisma: Great is eating, as it distanced two clans from the Jewish people, as it is stated: Lord…because they met you not with bread and with water” And Rabbi Yoḥanan himself says: distances the near, and draws near the distant, and averts eyes from the wicked, and causes the Divine Presence to rest on the prophets of the Baal; and an unwitting with regard to it considered an intentional
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said in the name of Rabbi Yosei ben Kisma: Great is charity, for it distances two families from Israel, as it is said, "Because they met you not with bread and with water." And Rabbi Yochanan himself said: It distances the close and brings near the distant, and it conceals the eyes from the wicked, and it spreads the Divine Presence over the prophets of Baal, and his unintentional sin is considered intentional.

hebrew_text: מְרַחֶקֶת אֶת הַקְּרוֹבִים
human_translation: distances the near
llm_translation: Distance the close ones.

hebrew_text: מֵעַמּוֹן וּמוֹאָב
human_translation: from Ammon and Moab.
llm_translation: From Ammon and Moab

hebrew_text: וּמְקָרֶבֶת אֶת הָרְחוֹקִים  מִיִּתְרוֹ דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בִּשְׂכַר קִרְאֶן לוֹ וְיֹאכַל לָחֶם זָכוּ בְּנֵי בָנָיו וְיָשְׁבוּ בְּלִשְׁכַּת הַגָּזִית שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וּמִשְׁפְּחוֹת סוֹפְרִים יֹשְׁבֵי יַעְבֵּץ תִּרְעָתִים שִׁמְעָתִים שׂוּכָתִים הֵמָּה הַקִּינִים הַבָּאִים מֵחַמַּת אֲבִי בֵית רֵכָב וּכְתִיב הָתָם  וּבְנֵי קֵינִי חֹתֵן מֹשֶׁה עָלוּ מֵעִיר הַתְּמָרִים אֶת בְּנֵי יְהוּדָה מִדְבַּר יְהוּדָה אֲשֶׁר בְּנֶגֶב עֲרָד וַיֵּלֶךְ וַיֵּשֶׁב אֶת הָעָם
human_translation: And draws near the distant from Yitro, as Rabbi Yoḥanan says: In reward “Call him, that he may eat bread” descendants were privileged and sat in the Chamber of Hewn Stone. As it is stated: “And the families of the scribes who dwelt in Jabez; the Tirathites, the Shimeathites, the Sucathites. These were the Kenites who came of Hammath, father of the house of Rechab” And it is written there “And the children of the Kenite, Moses’ father-in-law, went up from the city of the palm trees with the children of Judah into the wilderness of Judah, which is in the south of Arad; and they went and dwelt with the people”
llm_translation: And bringing near the distant ones, from the surplus, as Rabbi Yochanan said: in reward for calling to him, "and he shall eat bread," the descendants of his descendants merited, and they dwelt in the Chamber of the Gazith, as it is stated, "And the families of the scribes, the inhabitants of Jabez, Tirathites, Shimeathites, Sucathites. They are the Kenites, who came from Hammath, the father of the house of Rechab." And it is written there, "And the sons of the Kenite, the father-in-law of Moses, went up from the city of date palms, with the sons of Judah, to the wilderness of Judah, which is in the Negev of Arad, and they went and settled among the people."

hebrew_text: וּמַעֲלֶמֶת עֵינַיִם מִן הָרְשָׁעִים  מִמִּיכָה
human_translation: And averts eyes from the wicked from Micah,
llm_translation: And the concealment of eyes from the wicked is from Micah.

hebrew_text: וּמַשְׁרָה שְׁכִינָה עַל נְבִיאֵי הַבַּעַל  מֵחֲבֵירוֹ שֶׁל עִדּוֹ הַנָּבִיא דִּכְתִיב וַיְהִי הֵם יֹשְׁבִים אֶל הַשֻּׁלְחָן וַיְהִי דְּבַר ה' אֶל הַנָּבִיא אֲשֶׁר הֱשִׁיבוֹ
human_translation: And causes the Divine Presence to rest on the prophets of the Baal from the colleague of Iddo the prophet, as it is written: “And it happened as they sat at the table, that the word of the Lord came to the prophet that brought him back”
llm_translation: And the Divine Presence rested upon the prophets of Baal from his colleague of Iddo the prophet, as it is written, "And they were sitting at the table, and the word of the Lord came to the prophet who had brought him back."

hebrew_text: וְשִׁגְגָתָהּ עוֹלָה זָדוֹן  דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב אִלְמָלֵי הִלְווֹהוּ יְהוֹנָתָן לְדָוִד שְׁתֵּי כִּכְּרוֹת לֶחֶם לֹא נֶהֶרְגָה נוֹב עִיר הַכֹּהֲנִים וְלֹא נִטְרַד דּוֹאֵג הָאֲדֹמִי וְלֹא נֶהֱרַג שָׁאוּל וּשְׁלֹשֶׁת בָּנָיו
human_translation: And an unwitting with regard to it considered an intentional as Rav Yehuda says Rav says: Had Jonathan lent David two loaves of bread Nov, city of the priests, would not have been killed, and Doeg the Edomite would not have been banished and Saul and his three sons would not have been killed
llm_translation: And her unintentional sin is an offering of arrogance, as Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: Had Yehonatan lent David two loaves of bread, Nov, the city of the priests, would not have been destroyed; Doeg the Edomite would not have been troubled, and Saul and his three sons would not have been killed.

hebrew_text: וּמִפְּנֵי מָה לֹא מָנוּ אֶת אָחָז אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה בַּר אַבָּא מִפְּנֵי שֶׁמּוּטָל בֵּין שְׁנֵי צַדִּיקִים בֵּין יוֹתָם לְחִזְקִיָּהוּ רַב יוֹסֵף אָמַר מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהָיָה לוֹ בּשֶׁת פָּנִים מִישַׁעְיָהוּ שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וַיֹּאמֶר ה' אֶל יְשַׁעְיָהוּ צֵא נָא לִקְרַאת אָחָז אַתָּה וּשְׁאָר יָשׁוּב בְּנֶךָ אֶל קְצֵה תְּעָלַת הַבְּרֵכָה הָעֶלְיוֹנָה אֶל מְסִלַּת שְׂדֵה כוֹבֵס מַאי כּוֹבֵס אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי דְּכַבְשִׁינְהוּ לְאַפֵּיהּ וַחֲלַף וְאִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי אוּכְלָא דְּקַצָּרֵי סְחַף אַרֵישֵׁיהּ וַחֲלַף
human_translation: And for what did not enumerate Ahaz Rabbi Yirmeya bar Abba says: because he is cast between two righteous between Jotham, and Hezekiah. Rav Yosef says: because he had embarrassment from Isaiah as it is stated: “And the Lord said to Isaiah: Go out now to meet Ahaz, you, and Shear-Jashub your son, at the end of the aqueduct of the upper pool in the highway of the launderer’s [ koves ] field” What koves ? There are who say: as concealed [ dekhavshinhu ] his face and passed by And there are who say: He placed a launderer’s vessel over his head and passed by
llm_translation: And why did they not count Ahaz? Rabbi Yirmiyah bar Abba said: Because he was suspended between two righteous individuals, between Jotham and Hezekiah. Rav Yosef said: Because he had a brazen face like that of Isaiah, as it is said, "And the Lord said to Isaiah, 'Go out now to meet Ahaz, you and Shear-jashub your son, at the end of the conduit of the upper pool, by the highway of the fuller's field.'" What is the fuller's field? Some say it is where they would subdue it for its wool, and it changed, and some say it is the place where they would spread out the flax to dry, and it changed.

hebrew_text: מִפְּנֵי מָה לֹא מָנוּ אֶת אָמוֹן מִפְּנֵי כְּבוֹדוֹ שֶׁל יֹאשִׁיָּהוּ מְנַשֶּׁה נָמֵי לָא נִמְנֵי מִפְּנֵי כְּבוֹדוֹ שֶׁל חִזְקִיָּהוּ בְּרָא מְזַכֵּי אַבָּא אַבָּא לָא מְזַכֵּי בְּרָא דִּכְתִיב וְאֵין מִיָּדִי מַצִּיל אֵין אַבְרָהָם מַצִּיל אֶת יִשְׁמָעֵאל אֵין יִצְחָק מַצִּיל אֶת עֵשָׂו הַשְׁתָּא דְּאָתֵית לְהָכִי אָחָז נָמֵי לָא אִימְּנִי מִשּׁוּם כְּבוֹדוֹ שֶׁל חִזְקִיָּהוּ
human_translation: For what did not enumerate Amon due to the honor of Josiah, Let us also not enumerate Manasseh due to the honor of Hezekiah, The son confers merit upon the father, the father does not confer merit upon the son, as it is written: “None delivers from My hand” Abraham does not deliver Ishmael Isaac does not deliver Esau Now that you have arrived at this Ahaz too was not enumerated due to the honor of Hezekiah.
llm_translation: Because why not counted the Ammon because of the honor of Josiah Manasseh indeed not counted because of the honor of Hezekiah son created purifiers grandfather not purifiers son as it is written "And from my hand saves, Abraham saves Ishmael, Isaac saves Esau" the difference that you come to this Ahaz indeed not believed because of the honor of Hezekiah.

hebrew_text: וּמִפְּנֵי מָה לֹא מָנוּ אֶת יְהוֹיָקִים מִשּׁוּם דְּרַבִּי חִיָּיא בְּרַבִּי אֲבוּיָה דְּאָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בְּרַבִּי אֲבוּיָה כְּתִיב עַל גּוּלְגׇּלְתּוֹ [שֶׁל ] יְהוֹיָקִים זֹאת וְעוֹד אַחֶרֶת זְקֵינוֹ דְּרַבִּי פְּרִידָא אַשְׁכַּח גּוּלְגֻּלְתָּא דַּהֲוָה קָא שַׁדְיָא בְּשַׁעֲרֵי יְרוּשָׁלַיִם וּכְתִיב בָּהּ זֹאת וְעוֹד אַחֶרֶת קַבְרַהּ וְלָא אִיקְּבַרָא קַבְרַהּ וְלָא אִיקְּבַרָא
human_translation: And for what did not enumerate Jehoiakim due to that Rabbi Ḥiyya, son of Rabbi Avuya, as Rabbi Ḥiyya, son of Rabbi Avuya, says: It was written on the skull of Jehoiakim: This and yet another, Rabbi Perida’s grandfather, found a skull that was cast near the gates of Jerusalem, and on it was written: This and yet another. He buried it, but it did not buried. He buried it and it did not buried.
llm_translation: And because of what they did not count Yehoyakim because of Rabbi Hiyya son of Rabbi Avuya who said Rabbi Hiyya son of Rabbi Avuya wrote on the skull of Yehoyakim this and another elder of Rabbi Perida found a skull that was rolling in the gates of Jerusalem and it was written on it this and another her grave and she was not buried and she was not buried.

hebrew_text: אָמַר גּוּלְגׇּלְתּוֹ שֶׁל יְהוֹיָקִים הִיא דִּכְתִיב בֵּיהּ קְבוּרַת חֲמוֹר יִקָּבֵר סָחוֹב וְהַשְׁלֵךְ וְגוֹ' אֲמַר מַלְכָּא הוּא וְלָא אִיפְשָׁר לְזַלְזוֹלֵי בֵּיהּ כַּרְכַהּ בְּשִׁירָאֵי וְאוֹתְבַהּ בְּסִיפְתָּא חֲזֵיתַהּ דְּבֵיתְהוּ סְבַרָא הָא דְּאִיתְּתָא קַמַּיְיתָא הֲוָה דְּהָא לָא קָא מִנְּשֵׁי לַהּ שְׁגַרָא תַּנּוּרָא וְקַלְתַּהּ הַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב זֹאת וְעוֹד אַחֶרֶת
human_translation: He said: This is the skull of Jehoiakim, as it is written in his “He shall be buried with the burial of a donkey, drawn and cast forth said: He is a king, and it is inappropriate to display contempt for it. He wrapped in silk and placed it in a box. His wife saw thought: This was of first wife, as he is not forgetting her. She ignited the oven and incinerated That is which is written This and yet another.
llm_translation: He said: The skull of Jehoiakim, as it is written in it, "The burial of a donkey shall be buried, dragged and thrown..." The king said: It is he, and it is not possible to treat it disrespectfully, as it is written in its scrolls and bound in its covers. You see that his household thought that the one who was standing in front of them was the one who had not been sent to her, the baker's oven and his basket, as it is written, "This and another."

hebrew_text: תניא אמר רבי שמעון בן אלעזר בשביל ׳והטוב בעיניך עשיתי׳ ׳מה אות׳ בשביל ׳מה אות׳  נכרים אכלו על שולחנו בשביל שנכרים אכלו על שולחנו גרם גלות לבניו מסייע ליה לחזקיה דאמר חזקיה כל המזמן עובד עבודה זרה לתוך ביתו ומשמש עליו גורם גלות לבניו שנאמר ומבניך אשר יצאו ממך [אשר תוליד] יקחו והיו סריסים בהיכל מלך בבל
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: Because of “And I have done what is good in Your eyes” “What shall be the sign Because of “What shall be the sign,” gentiles ate at his table. Because gentiles ate at his table, it caused exile of his descendants. supports Ḥizkiyya, as Ḥizkiyya said: Anyone who invites an idol worshipper into his house and serves him causes exile of his descendants, as it is stated: “And of your sons who shall issue from you, whom you shall beget, shall they take away; and they shall be eunuchs in the palace of the king of Babylonia”
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar said, "Because 'I have done what is good in Your eyes,' what sign did God do for this? Because the nations ate at His table, He caused His children to be exiled." This supports Hezekiah, for Hezekiah said, "Anyone who invites idol worship into his home and serves it, causes his children to be exiled," as it is stated, "And your sons who will come forth from you whom you will father, they will be eunuchs in the palace of the king of Babylon."

hebrew_text: וַיִּשְׂמַח עֲלֵיהֶם חִזְקִיָּהוּ וַיַּרְאֵם אֶת בֵּית נְכֹתֹה אֶת הַכֶּסֶף וְאֶת הַזָּהָב וְאֶת הַבְּשָׂמִים וְאֵת הַשֶּׁמֶן הַטּוֹב וְגוֹ' אָמַר רַב מַאי בֵּית נְכֹתֹה  אִשְׁתּוֹ הִשְׁקְתָה עֲלֵיהֶם וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר בֵּית גְּנָזָיו הֶרְאָה לָהֶם וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר זַיִן אוֹכֵל זַיִן הֶרְאָה לָהֶן
human_translation: “And Hezekiah was glad of them, and showed them his treasury [ beit nekhoto ], the silver and the gold, and the spices and the precious ointment” Rav says: What beit nekhoto ? his wife, poured for them. And Shmuel says: he showed them his treasury. Rabbi Yoḥanan says: he showed them a weapon it breaks weapon.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And Hezekiah rejoiced over them and showed them the house of his spices, the silver, the gold, the balsam, and the good oil, etc. Rav said, "What is 'the house of his spices'? He made his wife drink them." And Samuel said, "He showed them his treasure house." And Rabbi Yochanan said, "One who eats olive oil, show them olive oil."

hebrew_text: אֵיכָה יָשְׁבָה בָּדָד אָמַר רָבָא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִפְּנֵי מָה לָקוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל בְּאֵיכָה  מִפְּנֵי שֶׁעָבְרוּ עַל שְׁלֹשִׁים וָשֵׁשׁ כָּרֵיתוֹת שֶׁבַּתּוֹרָה
human_translation: “How [ eikha ] does the city sit solitary” Rava says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: For what were the Jewish people stricken with eikha ? due to that they violated thirty-six prohibitions punishable with karet that the Torah,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Eichah yashva vadad, amar Rava, amar Rabbi Yochanan, mipnei mah laqu Yisrael be'Eichah, mipnei she'avar'u al shloshim vashesh kareitot shebat Torah." English translation: "How did Israel sit alone? Rava said, Rabbi Yochanan said, Why did Israel recite Eichah? Because they transgressed thirty-six prohibitions in the Torah."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִפְּנֵי מָה לָקוּ בְּאָלֶף בֵּית  מִפְּנֵי שֶׁעָבְרוּ עַל הַתּוֹרָה שֶׁנִּיתְּנָה בְּאָלֶף בֵּית
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: For what were the Jewish people stricken, with alef beit , due to that they violated the Torah, which was given in alef beit .
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: Why did they receive punishment with the letter Aleph and Beit? Because they transgressed the Torah that was given with the letter Aleph and Beit.

hebrew_text: יָשְׁבָה בָּדָד אָמַר רָבָא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא אֲנִי אָמַרְתִּי וַיִּשְׁכֹּן יִשְׂרָאֵל בֶּטַח בָּדָד עֵין יַעֲקֹב אֶל אֶרֶץ דָּגָן וְתִירוֹשׁ אַף שָׁמָיו יַעַרְפוּ טָל עַכְשָׁיו  יִהְיֶה בָּדָד מוֹשָׁבָם הָעִיר רַבָּתִי עָם אָמַר רָבָא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן שֶׁהָיוּ מַשִּׂיאִין קְטַנָּה לְגָדוֹל וּגְדוֹלָה לְקָטָן כְּדֵי שֶׁיְּהוּ לָהֶם בָּנִים הַרְבֵּה
human_translation: sit solitary,” Rava says Rabbi Yoḥanan says the Holy One, Blessed be He, said: I said: “And Israel dwells in safety, the fountain of Jacob in solitude, to a land of grain and wine; also His heavens shall drop down dew” Now their dwelling shall be solitary “The city that was full of people” Rava says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: They would marry a younger female to an older male and an older female to a younger male so that they would have many children.
llm_translation: Sat alone Rava said Rabbi Yochanan said the Holy One, blessed be He, said: I said, "Let Israel dwell securely, alone, at the fountain of Jacob, in a land of grain and wine; his heavens shall drop down dew." Now, let Badad be their dwelling place, the great city of the people. Rava said Rabbi Yochanan said: They used to arrange marriages from a young girl to an older man, and from an older girl to a young man, so that they would have many children.

hebrew_text: הָיְתָה כְּאַלְמָנָה אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב כְּאַלְמָנָה וְלֹא אַלְמָנָה מַמָּשׁ אֶלָּא כְּאִשָּׁה שֶׁהָלַךְ בַּעְלָהּ לִמְדִינַת הַיָּם וְדַעְתּוֹ לַחֲזוֹר אֵלֶיהָ רַבָּתִי בַגּוֹיִם שָׂרָתִי בַּמְּדִינוֹת אָמַר רָבָא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁהֵן הוֹלְכִין נַעֲשִׂין שָׂרִים לַאֲדוֹנֵיהֶן
human_translation: “She became like a widow” Rav Yehuda says Rav says: Like a widow, but not an actual widow. Rather, like a woman whose husband has gone to a country overseas, and he intends to return to her. “Great among the nations, and princess among the provinces” Rava says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Every place they go, become princes to their masters
llm_translation: She was like a widow. Rav Yehudah said, Rav said: Like a widow, but not an actual widow, rather like a woman whose husband went to the country of the sea, and his intention is to return to her. My master among the nations, I served in the countries. Rava said, Rabbi Yochanan said: Any place they go, they appoint leaders for their masters.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן מַעֲשֶׂה בִּשְׁנֵי בְּנֵי אָדָם שֶׁנִּשְׁבּוּ בְּהַר הַכַּרְמֶל וְהָיָה שַׁבַּאי מְהַלֵּךְ אַחֲרֵיהֶם
human_translation: The Sages taught an incident involving two people who were taken captive on Mount Carmel, and their captor was walking behind them.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: There was an incident involving two individuals who were traveling on Mount Carmel, and Shabtai was walking behind them.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ אֶחָד מֵהֶם לַחֲבֵירוֹ 'גָּמָל שֶׁמְהַלֶּכֶת לְפָנֵינוּ סוֹמָא בְּאַחַת מֵעֵינֶיהָ וּטְעוּנָה שְׁתֵּי נוֹדוֹת אַחַת שֶׁל יַיִן וְאַחַת שֶׁל שֶׁמֶן וּשְׁנֵי בְּנֵי אָדָם הַמַּנְהִיגִים אוֹתָהּ אֶחָד יִשְׂרָאֵל וְאֶחָד גּוֹי' אָמַר לָהֶן [שַׁבַּאי] 'עַם קְשֵׁה עוֹרֶף מֵאֵין אַתֶּם יוֹדְעִין'
human_translation: One of said to the other: camel that is walking ahead of us is blind in one of its eyes and laden two wineskins, one with wine and one with oil. And two people are driving one a Jew and one a gentile. The captor said to them: Stiff-necked people, from where do you know
llm_translation: He said to one of them, to his fellow, "A camel that is walking before us is blind in one of its eyes, and it is loaded with two bundles, one of wine and one of oil, and two people are leading it, one Jew and one Gentile." Shabbai said to them, "A stiff-necked people you are, you do not know."

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ לוֹ 'גָּמָל מֵעֲשָׂבִים שֶׁלְּפָנֶיהָ מִצַּד שֶׁרוֹאָה אוֹכֶלֶת מִצַּד שֶׁאֵינָהּ רוֹאָה אֵינָהּ אוֹכֶלֶת וּטְעוּנָה שְׁתֵּי נוֹדוֹת אַחַת שֶׁל יַיִן וְאַחַת שֶׁל שֶׁמֶן שֶׁל יַיִן  מְטַפְטֵף וְשׁוֹקֵעַ וְשֶׁל שֶׁמֶן  מְטַפְטֵף וְצָף וּשְׁנֵי בְּנֵי אָדָם הַמַּנְהִיגִים אוֹתָהּ אֶחָד גּוֹי וְאֶחָד יִשְׂרָאֵל גּוֹי נִפְנֶה לַדֶּרֶךְ וְיִשְׂרָאֵל נִפְנֶה לִצְדָדִין'
human_translation: They said to him: camel from the grass that is before it, from the side that it sees, it eats, from the side that it does not see, it does not eat, And it is laden two wineskins, one with wine and one with oil, wine drips and sinks into and oil drips and floats And two people are driving one a Jew and one a gentile, the gentile defecates on the road and the Jew, to the sides defecate.
llm_translation: They said to him, "A camel of vegetables, if its face is towards the side where it sees, it eats; if its face is towards the side where it does not see, it does not eat. And it requires two bundles, one of wine and one of oil. The bundle of wine drips and absorbs, and the bundle of oil drips and floats. And two people leading it, one a non-Jew and one a Jew, if the non-Jew turns it towards the road, and the Jew turns it sideways."

hebrew_text: רָדַף אַחֲרֵיהֶם וּמָצָא כְּדִבְרֵיהֶם בָּא וּנְשָׁקָן עַל רֹאשָׁן וֶהֱבִיאָן לְבֵיתוֹ וְעָשָׂה לָהֶן סְעוּדָה גְּדוֹלָה וְהָיָה מְרַקֵּד לִפְנֵיהֶם וְאָמַר 'בָּרוּךְ שֶׁבָּחַר בְּזַרְעוֹ שֶׁל אַבְרָהָם וְנָתַן לָהֶם מֵחׇכְמָתוֹ וּבְכׇל מָקוֹם שֶׁהֵן הוֹלְכִין נַעֲשִׂין שָׂרִים לַאֲדוֹנֵיהֶם' וּפְטָרָן [וְהָלְכוּ] לְבָתֵּיהֶם לְשָׁלוֹם
human_translation: pursued and found in accordance with their statements. He came and kissed them on their head, and brought them to their house and prepared a great feast for them. And he was dancing before them and said: Blessed who chose the descendants of Abraham and granted of His wisdom to them, and in every place that they go they become princes to their lords. And he released them and they went to their houses in peace.
llm_translation: He pursued after them and found as their words, he came and kissed them on their heads, and brought them to his house, and made for them a great feast, and he was dancing before them, and said, "Blessed is He who chose the seed of Abraham and gave them of His wisdom, and in every place they go, they are made princes to their masters." And they departed and went to their homes in peace.

hebrew_text: בָּכֹה תִבְכֶּה בַּלַּיְלָה שְׁתֵּי בְּכִיּוֹת הַלָּלוּ לָמָּה אָמַר רַבָּה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אֶחָד עַל מִקְדָּשׁ רִאשׁוֹן וְאֶחָד עַל מִקְדָּשׁ שֵׁנִי בַּלַּיְלָה  עַל עִסְקֵי לַיְלָה שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וַתִּשָּׂא כׇּל הָעֵדָה וַיִּתְּנוּ אֶת קוֹלָם וַיִּבְכּוּ הָעָם בַּלַּיְלָה הַהוּא
human_translation: “She cries [ bakho tivke ] at night” These two cries, why Rabba says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: One over the First Temple, and one over the Second Temple, “at night” over matters of night, as it is stated “And all the congregation lifted up their voice, and the people cried that night”
llm_translation: In the night, you shall weep, two weepings. Why did Rabba say, Rabbi Yochanan said, one for the First Temple and one for the Second Temple, in the night, concerning the matters of that night, as it is said, "And the entire congregation lifted up their voice and cried, and the people wept on that night."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אוֹתוֹ הַיּוֹם לֵיל תִּשְׁעָה בְּאָב הָיָה אָמַר לָהֶן הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לְיִשְׂרָאֵל אַתֶּם בְּכִיתֶם בְּכִיָּה שֶׁל חִנָּם וַאֲנִי אֶקְבַּע לָכֶם בְּכִיָּה לְדוֹרוֹת
human_translation: Rabba says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: That day was the evening of the Ninth of Av. The Holy One, Blessed be He, said to the Jewish people: You cried an unwarranted cry, and I will establish for you cry for generations.
llm_translation: Rabba said, Rabbi Yochanan said: On that day, the eve of the ninth of Av, the Holy One, blessed be He, said to the children of Israel: You have wept a weeping of baseless hatred, and I will establish for you a weeping for generations.

hebrew_text: דָּבָר אַחֵר בַּלַּיְלָה  שֶׁכׇּל הַבּוֹכֶה בַּלַּיְלָה קוֹלוֹ נִשְׁמָע דָּבָר אַחֵר בַּלַּיְלָה  שֶׁכׇּל הַבּוֹכֶה בַּלַּיְלָה כּוֹכָבִים וּמַזָּלוֹת בּוֹכִין עִמּוֹ דָּבָר אַחֵר בַּלַּיְלָה  שֶׁכׇּל הַבּוֹכֶה בַּלַּיְלָה הַשּׁוֹמֵעַ קוֹלוֹ בּוֹכֶה כְּנֶגְדּוֹ מַעֲשֶׂה בְּאִשָּׁה אַחַת שְׁכֶנְתּוֹ שֶׁל רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל שֶׁמֵּת בְּנָהּ וְהָיְתָה בּוֹכָה עָלָיו בַּלַּיְלָה שָׁמַע רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל קוֹלָהּ וּבָכָה כְּנֶגְדָּהּ עַד שֶׁנָּשְׁרוּ רִיסֵי עֵינָיו לְמָחָר הִכִּירוּ בּוֹ תַּלְמִידָיו וְהוֹצִיאוּהָ מִשְּׁכוּנָתוֹ
human_translation: Alternatively, “at night” that anyone who cries at night, his voice is heard Alternatively, “at night” that anyone who cries at night, the stars and the constellations cry with him. Alternatively, “at night” that anyone who cries at night, one who hears his voice cries with him. an incident involving one woman, the neighbor of Rabban Gamliel, whose son died, and she would cry over his at night. Rabban Gamliel heard her voice and cried with her until his eyelashes fell The next day his students noticed that he and they removed from his neighborhood
llm_translation: Another matter at night, anyone who cries at night, his voice is heard. Another matter at night, when anyone cries at night, the stars and constellations cry with him. Another matter at night, when anyone cries at night, the one who hears his voice cries opposite him. There was an incident with one woman, a neighbor of Rabban Gamliel, whose son died, and she was crying for him at night. Rabban Gamliel heard her voice and cried opposite her until the corners of his eyes became moist. The next day, his students recognized him and took her out from her dwelling.

hebrew_text: וְדִמְעָתָהּ עַל לֶחֱיָהּ אָמַר רָבָא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן כְּאִשָּׁה שֶׁבּוֹכָה עַל בַּעַל נְעוּרֶיהָ שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר אֱלִי כִּבְתוּלָה חֲגֻרַת שַׂק עַל בַּעַל נְעוּרֶיהָ הָיוּ צָרֶיהָ לְרֹאשׁ אָמַר רָבָא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן כׇּל הַמֵּיצֵר לְיִשְׂרָאֵל נַעֲשָׂה רֹאשׁ שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר כִּי לֹא מוּעָף לַאֲשֶׁר מוּצָק לָהּ כָּעֵת הָרִאשׁוֹן הֵקַל אַרְצָה זְבֻלוּן וְאַרְצָה נַפְתָּלִי וְהָאַחֲרוֹן הִכְבִּיד דֶּרֶךְ הַיָּם עֵבֶר הַיַּרְדֵּן גְּלִיל הַגּוֹיִם אָמַר רָבָא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן כׇּל הַמֵּצִיק לְיִשְׂרָאֵל אֵינוֹ עָיֵף
human_translation: “And her tears are on her cheeks” Rava says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: like a woman who cries over the husband of her youth, as it is stated: “Lament like a virgin girded with sackcloth for the husband of her youth” “Her adversaries have become the head” Rava says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: anyone who torments the Jewish people becomes a leader, as it is stated: “For there is no weariness to him that is set against her; at the first He lightly afflicted the land of Zebulun, and the land of Naphtali and afterward He afflicted her more grievously by the way of the sea, beyond the Jordan and the Galilee of the nations” Rava says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: anyone who harasses Israel does not weary.
llm_translation: "And her tears on her cheek," Rava said, Rabbi Yochanan said: Like a woman who weeps for her youthful husband, as it is stated: "O virgin daughter of Zion, girded with sackcloth over the son of her youth." Her adversaries have become the head. Rava said, Rabbi Yochanan said: Anyone who causes distress to Israel becomes a leader, as it is stated: "For it is not a fleeting thing for those who are distressed by it, as in the former time he treated lightly the land of Zebulun and the land of Naphtali, but in the latter time he has made it glorious, the way of the sea, beyond the Jordan, Galilee of the nations." Rava said, Rabbi Yochanan said: Anyone who oppresses Israel does not become weary.

hebrew_text: לֹא אֲלֵיכֶם כׇּל עֹבְרֵי דֶרֶךְ אָמַר רָבָא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִכָּאן לְקוּבְלָנָא מִן הַתּוֹרָה כׇּל עֹבְרֵי דֶרֶךְ אָמַר רַב עַמְרָם אָמַר רַב עֲשָׂאוּנִי כְּעוֹבְרֵי עַל דָּת דְּאִילּוּ בִּסְדוֹם כְּתִיב וַה' הִמְטִיר עַל סְדֹם וְאִילּוּ בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם כְּתִיב מִמָּרוֹם שָׁלַח אֵשׁ בְּעַצְמֹתַי וַיִּרְדֶּנָּה  וְגוֹ' וּכְתִיב וַיִּגְדַּל עֲוֹן בַּת עַמִּי מֵחַטַּאת סְדֹם
human_translation: “It is nothing to you, all you who pass by” Rava says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: From here from the Torah for complaint, “all you who pass by,” Rav Amram says Rav says They have rendered me like those who violate the precepts as, with regard to Sodom, it is written: “Then the Lord rained upon Sodom while with regard to Jerusalem, it is written: “From above He has sent fire into my bones, and it prevails And it is written: “For the iniquity of the daughter of my people is greater than the sin of Sodom”
llm_translation: Not to you all passersby way said Rava said Rabbi Yochanan from here for acceptance from the Torah all passersby way said Rav Amram said Rav Asauni like passersby on law that even in Sodom written "and Hashem caused to rain upon Sodom" and if in Jerusalem written "from on high He sent fire into my bones and it prevailed against them" and it is written "and the sin of the daughter of my people became greater than the sin of Sodom."

hebrew_text: וְכִי מַשּׂוֹא פָּנִים יֵשׁ בַּדָּבָר אָמַר רָבָא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִדָּה יְתֵירָה הָיְתָה בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם שֶׁלֹּא הָיְתָה בִּסְדוֹם דְּאִילּוּ בִּסְדוֹם כְּתִיב הִנֵּה זֶה הָיָה עֲוֹן סְדֹם אֲחוֹתֵךְ גָּאוֹן שִׂבְעַת לֶחֶם וְיַד עָנִי וְאֶבְיוֹן לֹא הֶחֱזִיקָה וְגוֹ' וְאִילּוּ בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם כְּתִיב יְדֵי נָשִׁים רַחֲמָנִיּוֹת בִּשְּׁלוּ יַלְדֵיהֶן
human_translation: And is there partiality in the matter? Rava says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: was an additional measure in Jerusalem that was not in Sodom, as with regard to Sodom it is written: “Behold this was the iniquity of your sister Sodom; pride, surfeit of bread and yet she did not strengthen the hand of the poor and needy” Whereas, with regard to Jerusalem it is written: “The hands of compassionate women cooked their own children”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And is there partiality in the matter?" Rava said, Rabbi Yochanan said: There was an extra measure in Jerusalem that was not in Sodom, for if it were in Sodom, it is written, 'Behold, this was the iniquity of Sodom, your sister: pride, fullness of bread, and abundance of idleness was in her and in her daughters, neither did she strengthen the hand of the poor and needy,' and so forth. But in Jerusalem it is written, 'The hands of compassionate women boiled their own children.'" English translation:

hebrew_text: סִלָּה כׇל אַבִּירַי ה' בְּקִרְבִּי  כְּאָדָם שֶׁאוֹמֵר לַחֲבֵרוֹ נִפְסְלָה מַטְבֵּעַ זוֹ
human_translation: “The Lord has spurned all my mighty men in the midst of me” that like a person who says to another: This coin was invalidated.
llm_translation: Rock, all my mighty of the Lord in my midst, like a person who says to his friend, "This coin is invalidated."

hebrew_text: פָּצוּ עָלַיִךְ פִּיהֶם אָמַר רָבָא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בִּשְׁבִיל מָה הִקְדִּים פֵּא לְעַיִן בִּשְׁבִיל מְרַגְּלִים שֶׁאָמְרוּ בְּפִיהֶם מַה שֶּׁלֹּא רָאוּ בְּעֵינֵיהֶם
human_translation: “They have opened their mouths against you” Rava says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: For what precede peh to ayin for spies who said with their mouths [ befihem ] what they did not see with their eyes [ be’eineihem ].
llm_translation: "They have opened their mouths against me," said Rava, Rabbi Yochanan said: For what reason did the eyelash precede the eye? For the sake of the spies, as they said with their mouths what they did not see with their eyes."

hebrew_text: אֹכְלֵי עַמִּי אָכְלוּ לֶחֶם ה' לֹא קָרָאוּ אָמַר רָבָא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן כׇּל הָאוֹכֵל מִלַּחְמָן שֶׁל יִשְׂרָאֵל טוֹעֵם טַעַם לֶחֶם וְשֶׁאֵינוֹ אוֹכֵל מִלַּחְמָן שֶׁל יִשְׂרָאֵל אֵינוֹ טוֹעֵם טַעַם לֶחֶם ה' לֹא קָרָאוּ  רַב אָמַר אֵלּוּ הַדַּיָּינִין וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר אֵלּוּ מְלַמְּדֵי תִינוֹקוֹת
human_translation: “The eaters of My people ate bread, and they call not upon the Lord” Rava says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Any who eats the bread of the Jewish people tastes the flavor of bread, and one who does not eat from the bread of the Jewish people does not taste the flavor of bread. “And they call not upon the Lord,” Rav says: These are the judges and Shmuel says: These are schoolteachers
llm_translation: Eaters of the fat of my people have eaten the bread of the Lord, they did not call. Rava said, Rabbi Yochanan said: Anyone who eats from the bread of Israel tastes the taste of bread, and one who does not eat from the bread of Israel does not taste the taste of the bread of the Lord, they did not call. Rav said: These are the judges, and Shmuel said: These are the teachers of young children.

hebrew_text: מִי מְנָאָן אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי אַנְשֵׁי כְּנֶסֶת הַגְּדוֹלָה מְנָאוּם אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב בִּקְּשׁוּ עוֹד לִמְנוֹת אֶחָד בָּאָה דְּמוּת דְּיוֹקְנוֹ שֶׁל אָבִיו וְנִשְׁ[תַּ]טְּחָה לִפְנֵיהֶם וְלֹא הִשְׁגִּיחוּ עָלֶיהָ בָּאָה אֵשׁ מִן הַשָּׁמַיִם וְלִחֲכָה (אֵשׁ) בְּסַפְסְלֵיהֶם  וְלֹא הִשְׁגִּיחוּ עָלֶיהָ
human_translation: Who enumerated them? Rav Ashi says: The members of the Great Assembly enumerated them. Rav Yehuda says Rav says: They sought to enumerate one more, The image of the face of his father, came and prostrated itself before them, and they paid it no heed. A fire came from Heaven and the fire scorched their benches [ safseleihem ], and they paid it no heed.
llm_translation: Who counted? Said Rav Ashi, the men of the Great Assembly counted. Said Rav Yehudah, said Rav, they sought to count one more, the likeness of his father's image appeared and frightened them, and they did not pay attention to it. Fire came down from heaven and rested on their benches, and they did not pay attention to it.

hebrew_text: יָצְאָה בַּת קוֹל וְאָמְרָה לָהֶם חָזִיתָ אִישׁ מָהִיר בִּמְלַאכְתּוֹ לִפְנֵי מְלָכִים יִתְיַצָּב בַּל יִתְיַצֵּב לִפְנֵי חֲשֻׁכִּים מִי שֶׁהִקְדִּים בֵּיתִי לְבֵיתוֹ וְלֹא עוֹד אֶלָּא שֶׁבֵּיתִי בָּנָה בְּשֶׁבַע שָׁנִים וּבֵיתוֹ בָּנָה בִּשְׁלֹשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה שָׁנָה לִפְנֵי מְלָכִים יִתְיַצָּב [בַּל יִתְיַצֵּב] לִפְנֵי חֲשֻׁכִּים וְלֹא הִשְׁגִּיחַ עָלֶיהָ יָצְאָה בַּת קוֹל וְאָמְרָה הַמֵעִמְּךָ יְשַׁלְמֶנָּה כִּי מָאַסְתָּ כִּי אַתָּה תִבְחַר וְלֹא אֲנִי וְגוֹ'
human_translation: A Divine Voice emerged and said to “Do you see a man diligent in his business? He shall stand before kings; he shall stand not before obscure men” who preceded My House, to his house. Moreover, My House he built in seven years, and his house he constructed in thirteen years. “he shall stand before kings; he shall stand not before obscure men,” And they paid it no heed. A Divine Voice emerged and said: “Shall His recompense be as you will it? For you loathe it, so that you must choose, and not I?
llm_translation: A voice came out and said to them: "Have you seen a man diligent in his work? He will stand before kings; he will not stand before obscure men. One who hastened my house to his house, and not only that, but my house he built in seven years, and his house he built in thirteen years - he will stand before kings; he will not stand before obscure men. And he did not pay attention to it." A voice came out and said: "He who is with you will repay you, for you have despised, for you choose, and not I."

hebrew_text: דּוֹרְשֵׁי רְשׁוּמוֹת הָיוּ אוֹמְרִים כּוּלָּן בָּאִין לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר לִי גִלְעָד וְלִי מְנַשֶּׁה וְאֶפְרַיִם מָעוֹז רֹאשִׁי יְהוּדָה מְחֹקְקִי מוֹאָב סִיר רַחְצִי עַל אֱדוֹם אַשְׁלִיךְ נַעֲלִי עָלַי פְּלֶשֶׁת הִתְרוֹעָעִי לִי גִלְעָד (וְלִי מְנַשֶּׁה) זֶה אַחְאָב שֶׁנָּפַל בְּרָמוֹת גִּלְעָד מְנַשֶּׁה כְּמַשְׁמָעוֹ אֶפְרַיִם מָעוֹז רֹאשִׁי זֶה יָרׇבְעָם דְּקָאָתֵי מֵאֶפְרַיִם יְהוּדָה מְחֹקְקִי זֶה אֲחִיתוֹפֶל
human_translation: Those who interpret the Torah metaphorically would say: All of enter the World-to-Come, as it is stated: “Gilead is Mine, and Manasseh is Mine, and Ephraim also is the strength of My head; Judah is My scepter; Moab is My washing pot; over Edom I will cast My shoe; Philistia, cry aloud because of Me” “Gilead is Mine and Manasseh is Mine”; this Ahab, who fell in Ramoth Gilead. “Manasseh”, in its plain meaning, “Ephraim also is the strength of My head”; this Jeroboam, who comes Ephraim. “Judah is My scepter”; this Ahithophel,
llm_translation: Interpreters of verses used to say: All of them come to the world, as it is stated, "To me, Gilead is mine, and Menasheh is mine; and Ephraim is the strength of my head; Judah is my lawgiver; Moab is my washpot; over Edom I will cast my shoe; Philistia, shout aloud because of me." "To me, Gilead is mine" (and Menasheh is mine) - this is Ahab who fell in Ramoth-Gilead. "Menasheh" - as his name implies. "Ephraim is the strength of my head" - this is Jeroboam who came from Ephraim. "Judah is my lawgiver" - this is Ahithophel.

hebrew_text: דְּקָאָתֵי מִיהוּדָה מוֹאָב סִיר רַחְצִי  זֶה גֵּחֲזִי שֶׁלָּקָה עַל עִסְקֵי רְחִיצָה עַל אֱדוֹם אַשְׁלִיךְ נַעֲלִי  זֶה דּוֹאֵג הָאֲדוֹמִי עָלַי פְּלֶשֶׁת הִתְרוֹעָעִי  אָמְרוּ מַלְאֲכֵי הַשָּׁרֵת לִפְנֵי הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם אִם יָבֹא דָּוִד שֶׁהָרַג אֶת הַפְּלִשְׁתִּי וְהוֹרִישׁ אֶת בָּנֶיךָ גַּת מָה אַתָּה עוֹשֶׂה לוֹ אָמַר לָהֶן עָלַי לַעֲשׂוֹתָן רֵיעִים זֶה לָזֶה
human_translation: who comes from Judah. “Moab is My washing pot”; this Gehazi, who was afflicted over matters of washing, “Over Edom I will cast My shoe”; this Doeg the Edomite. “Philistia, cry aloud [ hitroa’i ] because of Me”; the ministering angels said before the Holy One, Blessed be He: Master of the Universe, if David, who killed the Philistine and bequeathed Gath to your sons, will come what will You do concerning him? said to It is upon me to render friends [ re’im ] with each other,
llm_translation: Judah from Moab was boiling a pot, Gehazi was scrubbing on the matters of bathing, Edom I will throw my shoe, Doeg the Edomite was stirring up Philistia. The ministering angels said before the Holy One, blessed be He: "Master of the Universe, if David who killed the Philistine and drove out your children from Gath, what will you do to him?" He said to them: "It is upon me to make them friends, one to another."

hebrew_text: מַדּוּעַ שׁוֹבְבָה הָעָם הַזֶּה יְרוּשָׁלִַים מְשֻׁבָה נִצַּחַת וְגוֹ' אָמַר רַב תְּשׁוּבָה נִצַּחַַת הֵשִׁיבָה כְּנֶסֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל לַנָּבִיא אָמַר לָהֶן נָבִיא לְיִשְׂרָאֵל חִזְרוּ בִּתְשׁוּבָה אֲבוֹתֵיכֶם שֶׁחָטְאוּ הֵיכָן הֵם אָמְרוּ (לָהֶן) [לוֹ] וּנְבִיאֵיכֶם שֶׁלֹּא חָטְאוּ הֵיכָן הֵם שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר אֲבוֹתֵיכֶם אַיֵּה הֵם וְהַנְּבִאִים הַלְעוֹלָם יִחְיוּ אָמַר לָהֶן (אֲבוֹתֵיכֶם) חָזְרוּ וְהוֹדוּ שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר 'אַךְ דְּבָרַי וְחֻקַּי אֲשֶׁר צִוִּיתִי אֶת עֲבָדַי הַנְּבִיאִים' וְגוֹ'
human_translation: “Why is this people of Jerusalem slid back in perpetual backsliding?” Rav says: The congregation of Israel answered a convincing response to the prophet. The prophet said to the Jewish people: Repent, your ancestors sinned, where are they? They said And your prophets who did not sin, where are they? as it is stated: “Your fathers, where are they, and the prophets; do they live forever?” said to Your ancestors reconsidered and conceded as it is stated: “By my words and My statutes, which I commanded My servants the prophets,
llm_translation: Why is this nation rebellious, Jerusalem a perpetual rebellion, etc.? Rav said: Return, O rebellious children, says the Assembly of Israel to the prophet. The prophet said to them, "Return in repentance, your forefathers who sinned, where are they?" And your prophets who did not sin, where are they? As it is said, "Your forefathers, where are they? And the prophets, do they live forever?" He said to them, "Your forefathers returned and confessed, as it is said, 'Only My words and My statutes that I commanded My servants the prophets,' etc."

hebrew_text: שְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר בָּאוּ עֲשָׂרָה בְּנֵי אָדָם וְיָשְׁבוּ לְפָנָיו אָמַר לָהֶן חִזְרוּ בִּתְשׁוּבָה אָמְרוּ לוֹ עֶבֶד שֶׁמְּכָרוֹ רַבּוֹ וְאִשָּׁה שֶׁגֵּרְשָׁהּ בַּעְלָהּ כְּלוּם יֵשׁ לָזֶה עַל זֶה כְּלוּם אָמַר לוֹ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לַנָּבִיא לֵךְ אֱמוֹר לָהֶן 'אֵי זֶה סֵפֶר כְּרִיתוּת אִמְּכֶם אֲשֶׁר שִׁלַּחְתִּיהָ אוֹ מִי מִנּוֹשַׁי אֲשֶׁר מָכַרְתִּי אֶתְכֶם לוֹ הֵן בַּעֲוֹנוֹתֵיכֶם נִמְכַּרְתֶּם וּבְפִשְׁעֵיכֶם שֻׁלְּחָה אִמְּכֶם'
human_translation: Shmuel says Ten people came and sat before He said to them: Repent. They said to a slave sold by his owner or a woman divorced by her husband, does this have any upon that The Holy One, Blessed be He, said to the prophet: Go say to them: “Where is your mother’s scroll of severance, with which I sent her away? Or to which of My creditors have I sold you? For your iniquities you sold yourselves and for your transgressions was your mother sent away”
llm_translation: Shmuel said: Ten people came and sat before Him. He said to them, "Repent." They said to Him, "A slave whose master sold him, and a woman whose husband divorced her, is there any blame on them?" The Holy One, blessed be He, said to the prophet, "Go and say to them, 'Where is the bill of your mother's divorce, whom I have sent away? Or to which of My creditors have I sold you? Behold, for your iniquities you were sold, and for your transgressions your mother was sent away.'"

hebrew_text: וְהַיְינוּ דְּאָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ מַאי דִּכְתִיב דָּוִד עַבְדִּי נְבוּכַדְנֶצַּר עַבְדִּי גָּלוּי וְיָדוּעַ לִפְנֵי מִי שֶׁאָמַר וְהָיָה הָעוֹלָם שֶׁעֲתִידִין יִשְׂרָאֵל לוֹמַר כָּךְ לְפִיכָךְ הִקְדִּים הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא וּקְרָאוֹ עַבְדּוֹ עֶבֶד שֶׁקָּנָה נְכָסִים עֶבֶד לְמִי נְכָסִים לְמִי
human_translation: And that is what Reish Lakish says: What which is written: “David, My slave” “Nebuchadnezzar, my slave” it is revealed and known before the One Who spoke and the world came into being, that the Jewish people are destined to say that Therefore, the Holy One, Blessed be He, preemptively called His slave. a slave who acquires property, the slave to whom the property to whom?
llm_translation: And this is what Reish Lakish said: What is the meaning of what is written, "David, My servant, Nebuchadnezzar, My servant, revealed and known before Whom spoke and it will be the world that Israel is destined to say so"? Therefore, the Holy One, blessed be He, anticipated and called him His servant, a servant who acquired possessions, a servant to whom belong the possessions, to whom do the possessions belong.

hebrew_text: וְהָעֹלָה עַל רוּחֲכֶם הָיוֹ לֹא תִהְיֶה אֲשֶׁר אַתֶּם אֹמְרִים נִהְיֶה כַגּוֹיִם כְּמִשְׁפְּחוֹת הָאֲרָצוֹת לְשָׁרֵת עֵץ וָאָבֶן חַי אָנִי נְאֻם ה' אֱלֹהִים אִם לֹא בְּיָד חֲזָקָה וּבִזְרוֹעַ נְטוּיָה וּבְחֵמָה שְׁפוּכָה אֶמְלוֹךְ עֲלֵיכֶם אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן כֹּל כִּי הַאי רִיתְחָא לִירְתַּח רַחְמָנָא עֲלַן וְלִפְרוֹקִינַן
human_translation: “And what comes into your mind shall never come to be, that you say: We will be like the nations, like the families of the countries, to serve wood and stone. As I live, says the Lord God, surely with a mighty hand, and an outstretched arm, and with wrath poured out, will I rule over you” Rav Naḥman says: Let the Merciful One become wrathful at us all that wrath, and redeem us.
llm_translation: "And the burnt offering on your mind, it shall not be, 'We will be like the nations, like the families of the lands, to serve wood and stone.' As I live, says the Lord God, surely with a mighty hand, an outstretched arm, and poured-out wrath, I will reign over you." Rabbi Nachman said: "For whenever this wrath is kindled, may the Merciful One have mercy on us and redeem us."

hebrew_text: וְיִסְּרוֹ לַמִּשְׁפָּט אֱלֹהָיו יוֹרֶנּוּ אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר לָהֶן נָבִיא לְיִשְׂרָאֵל חִזְרוּ בִּתְשׁוּבָה אָמְרוּ לוֹ אֵין אָנוּ יְכוֹלִין יֵצֶר הָרָע שׁוֹלֵט בָּנוּ אָמַר לָהֶם יַסְּרוּ יִצְרֵיכֶם אָמְרוּ לוֹ אֱלֹהָיו יוֹרֶנּוּ
human_translation: “And chastise in judgment; his God will instruct him” Rabba bar bar Ḥana says the prophet said to the Jewish people: Repent. They said to him: We cannot, the evil inclination dominates us. He said to them: Chastise your inclinations. They said to him: “His God will instruct him,”
llm_translation: And they shall bring him to judgment, his God will instruct him. Rabba bar bar Ḥana said: A prophet said to the Israelites, "Return in repentance." They said to him, "We cannot, the evil inclination rules over us." He said to them, "Discipline your inclinations." They said to him, "His God will instruct him."

hebrew_text: אַרְבָּעָה הֶדְיוֹטוֹת בִּלְעָם וְדוֹאֵג וַאֲחִיתוֹפֶל וְגֵחֲזִי בִּלְעָם בְּלֹא עָם דָּבָר אַחֵר בִּלְעָם שֶׁבִּלָּה עָם בֶּן בְּעוֹר שֶׁבָּא עַל בְּעִיר
human_translation: four commoners, Balaam, Doeg, Ahithophel, and Gehazi, Balaam Without a nation [ belo am ], Alternatively, Balaam who wore down the people [ bila am ]. son of Beor, who engaged in bestiality [ be’ir ].
llm_translation: Four commoners in Bilam, Doeg, Ahitophel, and Gehazi. Bilam without a nation, another matter. Bilam who ruined a nation, the son of Beor who came upon a city.

hebrew_text: תָּנָא הוּא בְּעוֹר הוּא כּוּשַׁן רִשְׁעָתַיִם הוּא לָבָן הָאֲרַמִּי בְּעוֹר  שֶׁבָּא עַל בְּעִיר כּוּשַׁן רִשְׁעָתַיִם  דַּעֲבַד שְׁתֵּי רִשְׁעָיוֹת בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל אַחַת בִּימֵי יַעֲקֹב וְאַחַת בִּימֵי שְׁפוֹט הַשּׁוֹפְטִים וּמָה שְׁמוֹ  לָבָן הָאֲרַמִּי שְׁמוֹ
human_translation: taught He is Beor, he is Cushan-Rishathaim, he is Laban the Aramean. Beor because he engaged in bestiality. Cushan-Rishathaim because he performed two evil deeds [ rishiyyot ] to the Jewish people, one during the time of Jacob, and one during the time when the judges judged. And what was his name? His name was Laban the Aramean.
llm_translation: A tanna taught: He was fair-skinned, he was like Kushan Rishataim, he was Laban the Aramean. He was fair-skinned, who came upon the city of Kushan Rishataim, who committed two wicked acts in Israel, one in the days of Jacob and one in the days of the Judges. And what is his name? Laban the Aramean is his name.

hebrew_text: כְּתִיב בֶּן בְּעוֹר וּכְתִיב בְּנוֹ בְעֹר אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָבִיו בְּנוֹ הוּא לוֹ בִּנְבִיאוּת
human_translation: It is written: “Son of Beor” and it is written “His son Beor” Rabbi Yoḥanan says father was his son in prophecy,
llm_translation: It is written "ben be'or" and it is written "bno be'or." Rabbi Yochanan said: His father is his son in prophecy.

hebrew_text: בִּלְעָם הוּא דְּלָא אָתֵי לְעָלְמָא דְּאָתֵי הָא אַחֲרִינֵי אָתוּ מַתְנִיתִין מַנִּי
human_translation: Balaam is one who does not come into the World-to-Come; but other come Whose the mishna?
llm_translation: Bilam hu d'lo atei l'alma d'atei ha acharinei atu matnitin mani

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ הִיא דְּתַנְיָא רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר 'יָשׁוּבוּ רְשָׁעִים לִשְׁאוֹלָה כׇּל גּוֹיִם שְׁכֵחֵי אֱלֹהִים' 'יָשׁוּבוּ רְשָׁעִים לִשְׁאוֹלָה'  אֵלּוּ פּוֹשְׁעֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל 'כׇּל גּוֹיִם שְׁכֵחֵי אֱלֹהִים'  אֵלּוּ פּוֹשְׁעֵי גּוֹיִים דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ וְכִי נֶאֱמַר 'בְּכׇל גּוֹיִם' וַהֲלֹא לֹא נֶאֱמַר אֶלָּא 'כׇּל גּוֹיִם שְׁכֵחֵי אֱלֹהִים' אֶלָּא 'יָשׁוּבוּ רְשָׁעִים לִשְׁאוֹלָה' מַאן נִינְהוּ  'כׇּל גּוֹיִם שְׁכֵחֵי אֱלֹהִים'
human_translation: It is Rabbi Yehoshua, as it is taught Rabbi Eliezer says: “The wicked shall be turned back to the netherworld, all that nations that forget God” “The wicked shall be turned back to the netherworld”; these are the sinners of the Jewish people, “All the gentiles that forget God”; these are the sinners of the gentiles. the statement of Rabbi Eliezer. Rabbi Yehoshua said to him: But is it stated like all of the gentiles? It is stated only: “All the gentiles that forget God.” Rather, the wicked shall be turned back to the netherworld, who are they? all the gentiles that forget God.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua is the one who taught, as Rabbi Eliezer says, "Let the wicked return to Sheol, all the nations who forget God." "Let the wicked return to Sheol" - these are the sinners of Israel. "All the nations who forget God" - these are the sinners of the nations. Rabbi Eliezer said to him, Rabbi Yehoshua, "But is it stated 'all the nations'? Was it not only stated 'all the nations who forget God'? Rather, 'Let the wicked return to Sheol.' Who are they? 'All the nations who forget God.'"

hebrew_text: וְאַף אוֹתוֹ רָשָׁע נָתַן סִימָן בְּעַצְמוֹ אָמַר תָּמֹת נַפְשִׁי מוֹת יְשָׁרִים אִם תָּמוֹת נַפְשִׁי מוֹת יְשָׁרִים  תְּהֵא אַחֲרִיתִי כָּמוֹהוּ וְאִם לָאו  הִנְנִי הוֹלֵךְ לְעַמִּי
human_translation: And that wicked person, also provided a sign with regard to himself. He said: “Let me die the death of the righteous, If I die the death of the righteous, my end will be like his, And if not “I will go to my people”
llm_translation: And also that wicked one gave a sign in himself, he said, "Let my soul die the death of the upright, and let my end be like his!" And if not, "Here I am going to my people."

hebrew_text: וַיֵּלְכוּ זִקְנֵי מוֹאָב וְזִקְנֵי מִדְיָן תָּנָא מִדְיָן וּמוֹאָב לֹא הָיָה לָהֶם שָׁלוֹם מֵעוֹלָם מָשָׁל לִשְׁנֵי כְּלָבִים שֶׁהָיוּ בָּעֵדֶר וְהָיוּ צְהוּבִּין זֶה לָזֶה בָּא זְאֵב עַל הָאֶחָד אָמַר הָאֶחָד 'אִם אֵינִי עוֹזְרוֹ הַיּוֹם הוֹרֵג אוֹתוֹ וּלְמָחָר בָּא עָלַי' הָלְכוּ שְׁנֵיהֶם וְהָרְגוּ הַזְּאֵב אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא הַיְינוּ דְּאָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי כַּרְכּוּשְׁתָּא וְשׁוּנָּרָא עֲבַדוּ הִלּוּלָא מִתַּרְבָּא דְּבִישׁ גַּדָּא
human_translation: “And the elders of Moab and the elders of Midian set out taught Midian and Moab never had peace a parable of two dogs that were with the flock, and they were hostile to one another. A wolf came one. The one said: If I do not help him, today he kills him and tomorrow he comes to me. They both went and killed the wolf. Rav Pappa says this that people say: A weasel [ karkushta ] and a cat made a wedding from the fat of the luckless.
llm_translation: Elders of Moab and elders of Midian went. Taught Midian and Moab not had peace from the world. A parable to two dogs that were in the flock and were yellow one to the other, a wolf came upon one, said the one, "If I do not help him today, he will kill him," and the next day it came upon me. Both of them went and killed the wolf. Rav Papa said, that is what people say, "Karkushta and Shunra did it, praise be to the one who created the miracle in the winepress."

hebrew_text: וַיֵּשְׁבוּ שָׂרֵי מוֹאָב עִם בִּלְעָם וְשָׂרֵי מִדְיָן לְהֵיכָן אֲזוּל כֵּיוָן דַּאֲמַר לְהוּ לִינוּ פֹה הַלַּיְלָה וַהֲשִׁיבֹתִי אֶתְכֶם דָּבָר אָמְרוּ כְּלוּם יֵשׁ אָב שֶׁשּׂוֹנֵא אֶת בְּנוֹ
human_translation: “And the princes of Moab stayed with Balaam” And to where did the princes of Midian go? Once said to them: “Lodge here this night, and I will bring you word said: is there any father who hates his son?
llm_translation: The princes of Moab stayed with Balaam, and the princes of Midian went to where? Since he said to them, "Stay here tonight, and I will bring back word to you," they said, "Nothing, there is a father who hates his son."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן חוּצְפָּא אֲפִילּוּ כְּלַפֵּי שְׁמַיָּא מַהֲנֵי מֵעִיקָּרָא כְּתִיב לֹא תֵלֵךְ עִמָּהֶם וּלְבַסּוֹף כְּתִיב קוּם לֵךְ אִתָּם אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת חוּצְפָּא מַלְכוּתָא בְּלָא תָּאגָא הִיא דִּכְתִיב וְאָנֹכִי הַיּוֹם רַךְ וּמָשׁוּחַ מֶלֶךְ וְהָאֲנָשִׁים הָאֵלֶּה בְּנֵי צְרוּיָה קָשִׁים מִמֶּנִּי וְגוֹ'
human_translation: Rav Naḥman says: Impudence is effective even toward Heaven. Initially, it is written “You shall not go with them” and ultimately it is written: “Rise up and go with them” Rav Sheshet says: Impudence is monarchy without a crown, as it is written: “And I am this day weak, though anointed king; and these men the sons of Zeruiah are too hard for me”
llm_translation: Rav Nachman of Chutzpa said: Even if they are as insolent as the face of the heavens, it is derived from the outset, as it is written, "Do not go with them," and ultimately it is written, "Arise, go with them." Rav Sheshet of Chutzpa said: The kingdom is without a crown, as it is written, "And I am this day weak and anointed king, and these men, the sons of Zeruiah, are too hard for me, etc."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בִּלְעָם חִיגֵּר בְּרַגְלוֹ אַחַת הָיָה שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וַיֵּלֶךְ שֶׁפִי שִׁמְשׁוֹן בִּשְׁתֵּי רַגְלָיו שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר שְׁפִיפֹן עֲלֵי אֹרַח הַנּוֹשֵׁךְ עִקְּבֵי סוּס בִּלְעָם סוֹמֵא בְּאַחַת מֵעֵינָיו הָיָה שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר שְׁתֻם הָעָיִן
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Balaam was disabled in one of his legs, as it is stated “And he went limping [ shefi ]” Samson in both his legs, as it is stated an adder [ shefifon ] in the path that bites the horse’s heels” Balaam was blind in one of his eyes, as it is stated: “Whose eye is open”
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: Balaam was lame in one foot, as it is stated, "And Samson went on two feet" (Judges 16:3), as it is stated, "A whip for the horse, a bridle for the donkey" (Proverbs 26:3). Balaam was blind in one eye, as it is stated, "The eye of the adulterer waits for twilight" (Job 24:15).

hebrew_text: קוֹסֵם בְּאַמָּתוֹ הָיָה כְּתִיב הָכָא נֹפֵל וּגְלוּי עֵינָיִם וּכְתִיב הָתָם וְהָמָן נֹפֵל עַל הַמִּטָּה וְגוֹ' אִיתְּמַר מָר זוּטְרָא אָמַר קוֹסֵם בְּאַמָּתוֹ הָיָה מָר בְּרֵיהּ דְּרָבִינָא אָמַר שֶׁבָּא עַל אֲתוֹנוֹ מַאן דְּאָמַר קוֹסֵם בְּאַמָּתוֹ הָיָה כְּדַאֲמַרַן וּמַאן דְּאָמַר בָּא עַל אֲתוֹנוֹ הָיָה כְּתִיב הָכָא כָּרַע שָׁכַב וּכְתִיב הָתָם בֵּין רַגְלֶיהָ
human_translation: was a diviner by his penis. It is written here: “Fallen, yet with opened eyes” and it is written there: “And Haman was fallen upon the divan It was stated Mar Zutra says: was a diviner by his penis. Mar, son of Ravina, says: He engaged in bestiality with his donkey. The one who says was a diviner by his penis as we stated. And the one who says he engaged in bestiality with his donkey It is written here: “He crouched, he lay down” and it is written there: “Between her legs
llm_translation: One who practices divination with his cubit, it was written here "fallen and revealed eyes," and it was written there "and Haman fell upon the bed, etc." It was stated: Mar Zutra said: One who practices divination with his cubit, it was Mar, the son of Ravina, said: "Whoever came upon his she-ass." Whoever said: "One who practices divination with his cubit," it is as we said. And whoever said: "came upon his she-ass," it was written here "bowed, lay down," and it was written there "between her legs."

hebrew_text: כָּרַע נָפַל שָׁכָב וְגוֹ'
human_translation: he sunk, he fell, he lay”
llm_translation: He bent, fell, lay down, etc.

hebrew_text: וְיֹדֵעַ דַּעַת עֶלְיוֹן הַשְׁתָּא דַּעַת בְּהֶמְתּוֹ לָא הֲוָה יָדַע דַּעַת עֶלְיוֹן הֲוָה יָדַע מַאי דַּעַת בְּהֶמְתּוֹ  דְּאָמְרִי לֵיהּ מַאי טַעְמָא לָא רָכְבַתְּ סוּסְיָא אֲמַר לְהוּ שְׁדַאי לֵהּו בִּרְטִיבָא
human_translation: “And he knows the knowledge of the Most High” Now, the knowledge of his animal he did not know, that the knowledge of the Most High he knew? What the knowledge of his animal? said to him: What is the reason that you did not ride horses? said to them: I brought in the pasture
llm_translation: "And knows knowledge of the Most High now knowledge in his animal not was known knowledge of the Most High was known what knowledge in his animal as they say to him what reason not rode my horse he said to them it is enough for them in the wetness."

hebrew_text: אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ הֲלֹא אָנֹכִי אֲתֹנְךָ לִטְעִינָא בְּעָלְמָא אֲשֶׁר רָכַבְתָּ עָלַי אַקְרַאי בְּעָלְמָא 'מֵעוֹדְךָ עַד הַיּוֹם הַזֶּה'
human_translation: said to him: “Am I not your donkey” Merely for burdens, “Upon which you have ridden” was mere happenstance “Your whole life until this day”
llm_translation: She said to him, "Am I not your donkey that you have ridden upon me all these years until this day?"

hebrew_text: וְלֹא עוֹד אֶלָּא שֶׁאֲנִי עוֹשָׂה [לְךָ] מַעֲשֵׂה אִישׁוּת בַּלַּיְלָה  כְּתִיב הָכָא הַהַסְכֵּן הִסְכַּנְתִּי וּכְתִיב הָתָם וַתְּהִי לוֹ סֹכֶנֶת
human_translation: Moreover, I perform a conjugal act for you at night. It is written here: “Was I ever wont [ hahasken hiskanti ] And it is written there “And let her be a companion [ sokhenet ] to him”
llm_translation: And not only that, but I am doing for you an act of kindness at night. It is written here "the one who benefits, I have benefited," and it is written there "and she became a benefactor to him."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מַאי וְיֹדֵעַ דַּעַת עֶלְיוֹן שֶׁהָיָה יוֹדֵעַ לְכַוֵּון אוֹתָהּ שָׁעָה שֶׁהַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא כּוֹעֵס בָּהּ
human_translation: Rather, what, “And he knows knowledge of the Most High”? he would know to determine the moment during which the Holy One, Blessed be He, is angry.
llm_translation: Rather what "And He knows the knowledge of the Most High" means that the Holy One, blessed be He, knew to direct that moment when He was angry with her.

hebrew_text: וְהַיְינוּ דְּקָאָמַר לְהוּ נָבִיא לְיִשְׂרָאֵל עַמִּי זְכָר נָא מַה יָּעַץ בָּלָק מֶלֶךְ מוֹאָב וּמֶה עָנָה אֹתוֹ בִּלְעָם בֶּן בְּעוֹר מִן הַשִּׁטִּים עַד הַגִּלְגָּל לְמַעַן דַּעַת צִדְקוֹת ה' מַאי לְמַעַן דַּעַת צִדְקוֹת ה'  אָמַר לָהֶן הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לְיִשְׂרָאֵל דְּעוּ נָא כַּמָּה צְדָקוֹת עָשִׂיתִי עִמָּכֶם שֶׁלֹּא כָּעַסְתִּי כׇּל אוֹתָן הַיָּמִים בִּימֵי בִּלְעָם הָרָשָׁע שֶׁאִילְמָלֵא כָּעַסְתִּי כׇּל אוֹתָן הַיָּמִים לֹא נִשְׁתַּיֵּיר מִשּׂוֹנְאֵיהֶן שֶׁל יִשְׂרָאֵל שָׂרִיד וּפָלִיט
human_translation: And that is what the prophet said to Israel: “My nation, remember what Balak, king of Moab, advised, and how Balaam, son of Beor, responded; from Shittim to Gilgal, so that you may know the righteous acts of the Lord” What “So that you may know the righteous acts of the Lord”? The Holy One, Blessed be He, said to Israel: Know how many acts of kindness I performed on your behalf, that I did not become angry all the days of Balaam the wicked, as had I become angry all those days, no remnant or refugee would have remained among the enemies of Israel,
llm_translation: And this is what he said to them: "Prophet to my people, remember now what counsel Balak king of Moab gave, and what Balaam son of Beor answered him, from Shittim to Gilgal, in order to know the righteousness of the Lord. What is 'in order to know the righteousness of the Lord'? The Holy One, blessed be He, said to Israel: 'Know now how many righteous acts I have performed with you, that I did not become angry all those days during the time of the wicked Balaam. For if I had become angry all those days, there would not have remained a remnant and survivor of the enemies of Israel.'"

hebrew_text: הַיְינוּ דְּקָאָמַר לֵיהּ בִּלְעָם לְבָלָק מָה אֶקֹּב לֹא קַבֹּה אֵל וְגוֹ' (אוֹתָן הַיּוֹם [הַיָּמִים] לֹא זָעַם ה') אֵל זֹעֵם בְּכׇל יוֹם וְכַמָּה זַעְמוֹ  רֶגַע שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר כִּי רֶגַע בְּאַפּוֹ חַיִּים בִּרְצוֹנוֹ וְגוֹ'
human_translation: That is what Balaam said to Balak: “How can I curse, whom God has not cursed? God is angry every day” And how long is His wrath? one moment, as it is stated: “For His anger endures but a moment; His favor is for a lifetime”
llm_translation: That is to say, as he said to Balak, "What shall I curse whom God has not cursed?" (Those days the days when the Lord has not been angry) God is angry every day, and how much is His anger? A moment, as it is said, "For a moment in His anger, life in His favor."

hebrew_text: אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא לָךְ עַמִּי בֹּא בַחֲדָרֶיךָ וּסְגֹר דְּלָתֶיךָ בַּעֲדֶךָ חֲבִי כִמְעַט רֶגַע עַד יַעֲבׇר זָעַם אֵימַת רָתַח בִּתְלָת שָׁעֵי קַמָּיָיתָא כִּי חָוְורָא כַּרְבָּלְתָּא דְּתַרְנְגוֹלָא כֹּל שַׁעְתָּא וְשַׁעְתָּא נָמֵי חָוְורָא כֹּל שַׁעְתָּא וְשַׁעְתָּא אִית בֵּיהּ סוּרְיָקֵי סוּמָּקֵי הָהִיא שַׁעְתָּא לֵית בֵּיהּ סוּרְיָקֵי סוּמָּקֵי
human_translation: If you wish, say “Come, my people, enter you into your chambers, and shut your doors about you; hide yourself for a brief moment, until the anger passes” when is angry? during the first three hours when the crest of the rooster is white Each and every hour is also white, each and every hour there are red streaks in at that moment there are no red streaks in
llm_translation: If you wish, I will say to you: "My nation, come into your chambers, and shut your doors behind you; hide for a little moment, until the indignation passes." When you are angry, let it not be for a moment, for wrath will flare up in a moment. Like the light of the morning, like the rising of the sun, like a cloud of dew in the heat of harvest, so is the wrath that comes in a moment. There is in it both Syrian and Samaritan, there is in it both Syrian and Samaritan.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא מִינָא דַּהֲוָה בְּשִׁיבָבוּתֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי דַּהֲוָה קָא מְצַעַר לֵיהּ יוֹמָא חַד נְקַט (תַּרְנְגוֹלְתָּא) [תַּרְנוּגְלָא] וַאֲסַר לֵיהּ בְּכַרְעֵיהּ וְאוֹתֵיב אָמַר כִּי מְטָא הָהוּא שַׁעְתָּא אֶילְטְיֵיהּ כִּי מְטָא הָהוּא שַׁעְתָּא נַמְנֵם אֲמַר שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ לָאו אוֹרַח אַרְעָא דִּכְתִיב גַּם עֲנוֹשׁ לַצַּדִּיק לֹא טוֹב אֲפִילּוּ בְּמִינֵי לָא אִיבְּעִי לֵיהּ לְמֵימַר הָכִי
human_translation: a certain heretic who was in Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi’s neighborhood who would upset him One day, took a rooster and tied it by its legs and sat He said: When that moment arrives, I will curse him. When that moment arrived, dozed off. he said: Conclude from not proper conduct as it is written: “Punishment, even for the righteous, is not good” Even with regard to heretics, should not state
llm_translation: That certain heretic who was in the neighborhood of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi, he was causing him distress one day, he took a (rooster) rooster and tied it by its leg, and sat down. He said, "When that hour comes, I will release it." When that hour came, he fell asleep. He said, "Hear from this, is it not the way of the land, as it is written, 'Even punishment for the righteous is not good' even with non-kosher animals, he wanted to say this."

hebrew_text: תָּנָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁהַחַמָּה זוֹרַחַת וְהַמְּלָכִים מַנִּיחִין כִּתְרֵיהֶן עַל רָאשֵׁיהֶן וּמִשְׁתַּחֲוִים לַחַמָּה מִיָּד כּוֹעֵס
human_translation: it was taught in the name of Rabbi Meir: When the sun rises and the kings place their crowns on their heads and bow down to the sun, the Holy One, Blessed be He, immediately grows angry.
llm_translation: It was taught in the name of Rabbi Meir: When the sun is shining and the kings place their crowns on their heads and bow down to the sun, immediately anger comes.

hebrew_text: וַיָּקׇם בִּלְעָם בַּבֹּקֶר וַיַּחֲבֹשׁ אֶת אֲתֹנוֹ תָּנָא מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אַהֲבָה מְבַטֶּלֶת שׁוּרָה שֶׁל גְּדוּלָּה מֵאַבְרָהָם דִּכְתִיב 'וַיַּשְׁכֵּם אַבְרָהָם בַּבֹּקֶר' שִׂנְאָה מְבַטֶּלֶת שׁוּרָה שֶׁל גְּדוּלָּה  מִבִּלְעָם שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר 'וַיָּקׇם בִּלְעָם בַּבֹּקֶר וַיַּחֲבֹשׁ אֶת אֲתֹנוֹ'
human_translation: “And Balaam rose in the morning and saddled his donkey” It was taught in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar: Love negates the standard of prominence. from Abraham, as it is written: “And Abraham rose early in the morning hatred negates the standard of prominence. from Balaam, as it is stated: “And Balaam rose early in the morning and saddled his donkey”
llm_translation: And Bilam arose in the morning and saddled his donkey. It was taught in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar: Love nullifies the decree of greatness, as with Abraham, as it is written, "And Abraham arose early in the morning." Hatred nullifies the decree of greatness, as with Bilam, as it is stated, "And Bilam arose in the morning and saddled his donkey."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב לְעוֹלָם יַעֲסוֹק אָדָם בְּתוֹרָה וּבְמִצְוָה אֲפִילּוּ שֶׁלֹּא לִשְׁמָהּ שֶׁמִּתּוֹךְ שֶׁלֹּא לִשְׁמָהּ בָּא לִשְׁמָהּ שֶׁבִּשְׂכַר אַרְבָּעִים וּשְׁתַּיִם קׇרְבָּנוֹת שֶׁהִקְרִיב בָּלָק זָכָה וְיָצְאָה מִמֶּנּוּ רוּת אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר הוּנָא רוּת בִּתּוֹ שֶׁל עֶגְלוֹן בֶּן בְּנוֹ שֶׁל בָּלָק מֶלֶךְ מוֹאָב הָיְתָה
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Rav says: A person should always engage in Torah and a mitzva even not for their own sake, as through not for their sake, come for their sake. as in reward for the forty-two offerings that Balak sacrificed, he was privileged and Ruth descended from him. Rabbi Yosei bar Huna says: Ruth was the daughter of Eglon, son of the son of Balak, king of Moab.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: A person should always engage in Torah study and observance of mitzvot, even if not for their own sake, for through studying not for its own sake, one will come to study for its own sake. As a reward for the forty-two sacrifices that Balak offered, Ruth the Moabite emerged from him. Rabbi Yosei bar Huna said: Ruth was the daughter of Eglon, the son of Balak, king of Moab.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא לְרַבָּה בַּר מָרִי כְּתִיב יֵיטֵב אֱלֹהִים אֶת שֵׁם שְׁלֹמֹה מִשְּׁמֶךָ וִיגַדֵּל [אֶת] כִּסְאוֹ מִכִּסְאֶךָ אוֹרַח אַרְעָא לְמֵימְרָא לֵיהּ לְמַלְכָּא הָכִי אֲמַר לֵיהּ מֵעֵין קָאָמְרָה לֵיהּ
human_translation: Rava said to Rabba bar Mari: It is written “May God make the name of Solomon better than your name and make his throne greater than your throne [ mikisekha ]” Is it proper conduct to speak to a king in that manner said to She said to him: of the nature
llm_translation: Rava said to Rabba bar Mari: It is written, "God shall make the name of Solomon better than your name, and his throne greater than your throne." He showed him a path in the field to say to the king thus: He said to him from a spring he said to him.

hebrew_text: דְּאִי לָא תֵּימָא הָכִי תְּבֹרַךְ מִנָּשִׁים יָעֵל אֵשֶׁת חֶבֶר הַקֵּינִי מִנָּשִׁים בָּאֹהֶל תְּבֹרָךְ נָשִׁים בָּאֹהֶל מַאן נִינְהוּ שָׂרָה רִבְקָה רָחֵל וְלֵאָה אוֹרַח אַרְעָא לְמֵימַר הָכִי אֶלָּא מֵעֵין קָאָמַר הָכִי נָמֵי מֵעֵין קָאָמַר
human_translation: As if you do not say so “Blessed above women Jael, wife of Heber the Kenite; blessed is she more than the women [ minashim ] in the tent” “The women in the tent,” who are they? Sarah, Rebecca, Rachel, and Leah. Is it proper conduct to speak in that manner Rather, of the nature says, So too Of the nature says.
llm_translation: If you do not say it like this: "Blessed above women shall Yael, the wife of Hever the Kenite, be, above women in the tent shall she be blessed." Who are these women? Sarah, Rivka, Rachel, and Leah. A traveler came to say it like this, but rather, it is from a similar vein that he said it. Indeed, from a similar vein did he say it.

hebrew_text: וּפְלִיגָא דְּרַב יוֹסֵי בַּר חוֹנִי דְּאָמַר רַב יוֹסֵי בַּר חוֹנִי בַּכֹּל אָדָם מִתְקַנֵּא חוּץ מִבְּנוֹ וְתַלְמִידוֹ בְּנוֹ מִשְּׁלֹמֹה וְתַלְמִידוֹ אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא וִיהִי נָא פִּי שְׁנַיִם בְּרוּחֲךָ אֵלָי וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא וַיִּסְמֹךְ אֶת יָדָיו עָלָיו וַיְצַוֵּהוּ
human_translation: disagrees of Rav Yosei bar Ḥoni, as Rav Yosei bar Ḥoni says: A person is jealous of everyone except for his son and his student. his son from Solomon And his student; if you wish, say “I pray you that a double portion of your spirit be upon me” And if you wish, say “And he laid his hands upon him and commanded him”
llm_translation: And the dispute of Rav Yosei bar Ḥoni, as Rav Yosei bar Ḥoni said: In all matters, a person is jealous except for his son and his student. His son is from Solomon, and his student, if you wish, I will say, "Let your mouth be two-fold in your spirit towards me." And if you wish, I will say, "And he laid his hands upon him and commanded him."

hebrew_text: וַיָּשֶׂם דָּבָר בְּפִי בִּלְעָם רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר מַלְאָךְ רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן אָמַר חַכָּה
human_translation: “And the Lord placed a matter in Balaam’s mouth” Rabbi Elazar says: an angel Rabbi Yonatan says: a hook
llm_translation: And placed word in mouth Balaam Rabbi Eliezer says angel Rabbi Jonathan says wait

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִבִּרְכָתוֹ שֶׁל אוֹתוֹ רָשָׁע אַתָּה לָמֵד מָה הָיָה בְּלִבּוֹ בִּיקֵּשׁ לוֹמַר שֶׁלֹּא יְהוּ לָהֶם בָּתֵּי כְנֵסִיּוֹת וּבָתֵּי מִדְרָשׁוֹת מַה טֹּבוּ אֹהָלֶיךָ יַעֲקֹב לֹא תִּשְׁרֶה שְׁכִינָה עֲלֵיהֶם וּמִשְׁכְּנֹתֶיךָ יִשְׂרָאֵל לֹא תְּהֵא מַלְכוּתָן נִמְשֶׁכֶת כִּנְחָלִים נִטָּיוּ לֹא יְהֵא לָהֶם זֵיתִים וּכְרָמִים כְּגִנַּת עֲלֵי נָהָר לֹא יְהֵא רֵיחָן נוֹדֵף כַּאֲהָלִים נָטַע ה'
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: From the blessing of that wicked person, you ascertain what was in his heart. He sought to say that they should not have synagogues and study halls, “How goodly are your tents, Jacob” that the Divine Presence [ shekhina ] will not rest upon them, “And your dwellings [ mishkenot ] Israel.” the kingdom of Israel would not continue, “Like the winding brooks” they would have no olive trees and vineyards, “Like gardens by the river’s side” their fragrance would not diffuse “Like aloes that the Lord has planted”
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: From the blessing of that wicked person, you learn what was in his heart. He sought to say, "May they not have synagogues and study halls." "How goodly are your tents, O Jacob, your dwelling places, O Israel. The Divine Presence shall not rest upon them, and their kingdom shall not be established like streams; they shall not have olives and vineyards like the gardens by the river, their fragrance shall not spread like tents pitched by God."

hebrew_text: לֹא יִהְיוּ לָהֶם מְלָכִים בַּעֲלֵי קוֹמָה כַּאֲרָזִים עֲלֵי מַיִם לֹא יִהְיֶה לָהֶם מֶלֶךְ בֶּן מֶלֶךְ יִזַּל מַיִם מִדָּלְיָו לֹא תְּהֵא מַלְכוּתָן שׁוֹלֶטֶת בָּאוּמּוֹת וְזַרְעוֹ בְּמַיִם רַבִּים לֹא תְּהֵא עַזָּה מַלְכוּתָן וְיָרֹם מֵאֲגַג מַלְכּוֹ לֹא תְּהֵא אֵימַת מַלְכוּתָן וְתִנַּשֵּׂא מַלְכֻתוֹ
human_translation: they would not have kings of stature, “Like cedar trees beside the waters” they will not have a king the son of a king, “Water shall flow from his branches” their kingdom would not rule over the nations, “And his seed shall be in many waters” their kingdom would not be fierce, “And his king shall be higher than Agag.” that there will be no fear of their kingdom, “And his kingdom shall be exalted”
llm_translation: They shall not have kings, rulers like cedars upon waters. They shall not have a king, son of a king, water dripping from his bucket. Their kingdom shall not dominate the nations, and their seed in abundant waters. Their kingdom shall not be strong, and exalted above Agag their king. Their kingdom shall not be feared, and his kingdom shall be exalted.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא בַּר כָּהֲנָא כּוּלָּם חָזְרוּ לִקְלָלָה חוּץ מִבָּתֵּי כְנֵסִיּוֹת וּמִבָּתֵּי מִדְרָשׁוֹת שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וַיַּהֲפֹךְ ה' אֱלֹהֶיךָ לְּךָ אֶת הַקְּלָלָה לִבְרָכָה כִּי אֲהֵבְךָ ה' אֱלֹהֶיךָ קְלָלָה וְלֹא קְלָלוֹת
human_translation: Rabbi Abba bar Kahana says: All of reverted to curse except for synagogues and study halls, as it is stated: “And the Lord your God transformed the curse into a blessing for you, because the Lord your God loved you” A curse not curses
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Abba bar Kahana: All of them returned to a curse, except for synagogues and study halls, as it is stated, "And the Lord your God turned the curse into a blessing for you, because the Lord your God loves you." A curse, and not curses.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן מַאי דִּכְתִיב נֶאֱמָנִים פִּצְעֵי אוֹהֵב וְנַעְתָּרוֹת נְשִׁיקוֹת שׂוֹנֵא  טוֹבָה קְלָלָה שֶׁקִּילֵּל אֲחִיָּה הַשִּׁילוֹנִי אֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל יוֹתֵר מִבְּרָכָה שֶׁבֵּרְכָם בִּלְעָם הָרָשָׁע אֲחִיָּה הַשִּׁילוֹנִי קִילֵּל אֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל בְּקָנֶה שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וְהִכָּה ה' אֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל כַּאֲשֶׁר יָנוּד הַקָּנֶה בַּמַּיִם  וְגוֹ' מָה קָנֶה זֶה עוֹמֵד בִּמְקוֹם מַיִם וְגִיזְעוֹ
human_translation: Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani says Rabbi Yonatan says: What which is written: “Faithful are the wounds of a friend; but the kisses of an enemy are importunate” Better is the curse that Ahijah the Shilonite cursed the Jewish people than the blessing that Balaam the wicked blessed them. Ahijah the Shilonite cursed Israel with a reed, as it is stated: “For the Lord shall smite Israel as a reed is shaken in water” just like a reed stands in a place water, and its stalk
llm_translation: Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said, Rabbi Yonatan said: What is the meaning of what is written, "Faithful are the wounds of a friend, but deceitful are the kisses of an enemy"? (Proverbs 27:6) Curses that Ahijah the Shilonite pronounced upon Israel were more effective than the blessings that Balaam the wicked blessed them with. Ahijah the Shilonite cursed Israel with a reed, as it is stated, "And the Lord will strike Israel as a reed is shaken in the water." (1 Kings 14:15) What is this reed that stands in a place of water? It is the spinal cord.

hebrew_text: מַחְלִיף וְשׇׁרָשָׁיו מְרוּבִּין וַאֲפִילּוּ כׇּל רוּחוֹת שֶׁבָּעוֹלָם בָּאוֹת וְנוֹשְׁבוֹת בּוֹ אֵין מְזִיזוֹת אוֹתוֹ מִמְּקוֹמוֹ אֶלָּא הוּא הוֹלֵךְ וּבָא עִמָּהֶן כֵּיוָן שֶׁדּוֹמְמוּ הָרוּחוֹת עָמַד קָנֶה בִּמְקוֹמוֹ
human_translation: replenishes and its roots are numerous. And even if all the winds that are in the world come and gust against it, they do not move it from its place Rather, it goes and comes with once the winds subside the reed remains in its place.
llm_translation: It exchanges and its roots are numerous, and even all the spirits in the world come and settle in it, they do not move it from its place, but it goes and comes with them, once the spirits become still, the reed stands in its place.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל בִּלְעָם הָרָשָׁע בֵּרְכָן בְּאֶרֶז מָה אֶרֶז זֶה אֵינוֹ עוֹמֵד בִּמְקוֹם מַיִם וְשׇׁרָשָׁיו מוּעָטִין וְאֵין גִּזְעוֹ מַחְלִיף אֲפִילּוּ כׇּל הָרוּחוֹת שֶׁבָּעוֹלָם בָּאוֹת וְנוֹשְׁבוֹת בּוֹ אֵין מְזִיזוֹת אוֹתוֹ מִמְּקוֹמוֹ כֵּיוָן שֶׁנָּשְׁבָה בּוֹ רוּחַ דְּרוֹמִית מִיָּד עוֹקַרְתּוֹ וְהוֹפַכְתּוֹ עַל פָּנָיו וְלֹא עוֹד אֶלָּא שֶׁזָּכָה קָנֶה לִיטּוֹל מִמֶּנּוּ קוּלְמוֹס לִכְתּוֹב מִמֶּנּוּ סִפְרֵי תוֹרָה נְבִיאִים וּכְתוּבִים
human_translation: But Balaam the wicked blessed them with a cedar. just like a cedar does not stand in a place water, and its roots are few and its trunk does not replenish even all the winds that are in the world come and gust against it, they do not move it from its place once a southern wind gusts it immediately uproots and overturns it on its face. Moreover, the reed that was privileged to a quill [ kulmos ] taken from it to write scrolls of Torah, Prophets, and Writings.
llm_translation: But Balaam the wicked blessed them with a cedar. What is this cedar? It does not stand in a place of water, and its roots are few, and its trunk does not change, even if all the winds in the world come and blow on it, they do not move it from its place. Once a southern wind blows on it, it uproots it and turns it on its face. Moreover, he merited that a reed would be taken from it to write from it the books of the Torah, Prophets, and Writings.

hebrew_text: וַיַּרְא אֶת הַקֵּינִי וַיִּשָּׂא מְשָׁלוֹ אָמַר לוֹ בִּלְעָם לְיִתְרוֹ קֵינִי לֹא הָיִיתָ עִמָּנוּ בְּאוֹתָהּ עֵצָה מִי הוֹשִׁיבְךָ אֵצֶל אֵיתָנֵי עוֹלָם
human_translation: “And he looked at the Kenite and he took up his parable Balaam said to Yitro: Kenite, you not in Egypt with us in that counsel Who placed you alongside the mighty of the world?
llm_translation: And he saw the Kenite, and he took up his discourse and said, "Bilam the son of Beor said to him, 'Though you are a Kenite, you were not with us in that counsel. Who has established you among the eternal foundations?'"

hebrew_text: וְהַיְינוּ דְּאָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי סִימַאי שְׁלֹשָׁה הָיוּ בְּאוֹתָהּ עֵצָה אֵלּוּ הֵן בִּלְעָם אִיּוֹב וְיִתְרוֹ בִּלְעָם שֶׁיָּעַץ  נֶהֱרַג אִיּוֹב שֶׁשָּׁתַק  נִידּוֹן בְּיִסּוּרִין וְיִתְרוֹ שֶׁבָּרַח  זָכוּ בְּנֵי בָנָיו לֵישֵׁב בְּלִשְׁכַּת הַגָּזִית שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וּמִשְׁפְּחוֹת סוֹפְרִים יוֹשְׁבֵי יַעְבֵּץ תִּרְעָתִים שִׁמְעָתִים שׂוּכָתִים הֵמָּה הַקִּינִים הַבָּאִים מֵחַמַּת אֲבִי בֵית רֵכָב וּכְתִיב וּבְנֵי קֵינִי חֹתֵן מֹשֶׁה עָלוּ מֵעִיר הַתְּמָרִים
human_translation: And that is what Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba says Rabbi Simai says: Three were in that counsel, and they are: Balaam, Job, and Yitro. Balaam, who advised was killed.
