Job, who was silent was sentenced to afflictions. And Yitro, who fled his descendants were privileged to sit in the Chamber of Hewn Stone, as it is stated: “And the families of the scribes who dwelt in Jabez; the Tirathites, the Shimeathites, the Sucathites. These were the Kenites who came of Hammath the father of the house of Rechab” And it is written there “And the children of the Kenite, Moses’ father-in-law, went up from the city of the palm trees”
llm_translation: And this is what Rabbi Chiya bar Abba said in the name of Rabbi Simai: There were three in that council, and they are Balaam, Job, and Jethro. Balaam, who advised, was killed. Job, who remained silent, was judged with suffering. And Jethro, who fled, merited that his descendants should sit in the Chamber of Hewn Stone, as it is said: "And the families of the scribes who dwelt at Jabez, the Tirathites, the Shimeathites, the Sucathites. They are the Kenites who came from Hammath, the father of the house of Rechab; and it is written: "And the sons of the Kenite, Moses' father-in-law, went up from the city of palm trees."

hebrew_text: וַיִּשָּׂא מְשָׁלוֹ וַיֹּאמַר אוֹי מִי יִחְיֶה מִשֻּׂמוֹ אֵל אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ אוֹי מִי שֶׁמְּחַיֶּה עַצְמוֹ בְּשֵׁם אֵל אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אוֹי לָהּ לָאוּמָּה שֶׁתִּמָּצֵא בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁהַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא עוֹשֶׂה פִּדְיוֹן לְבָנָיו מִי מֵטִיל כְּסוּתוֹ בֵּין לָבִיא לִלְבִיאָה בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁנִּזְקָקִין זֶה עִם זֶה
human_translation: “And he took up his parable, and said: Alas, he who lives from what God has appointed him” Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish says: Woe unto one who sustains himself in the name of God, Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Woe unto the nation that will be found at the time when the Holy One, Blessed be He, redeems His children. Who places his garment between a male lion and a female lion when they are mating?
llm_translation: He lifted his parable and said, "Woe, who will live from his own?!" Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said, "Woe, who sustains himself in the name of God!" Rabbi Yochanan said, "Woe to the nation that will be found at the time when the Holy One, blessed be He, redeems His children. Who will cast his garment between a lion and a lioness at the time when they are in need of each other."

hebrew_text: וְצִים מִיַּד כִּתִּים אָמַר רַב לִיבּוֹן אַסְפִּיר וְעִנּוּ אַשּׁוּר וְעִנּוּ עֵבֶר עַד אַשּׁוּר  קָטְלִי מִיקְטָל מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ  מְשַׁעְבְּדִי שַׁיעְבּוֹדֵי
human_translation: “And ships come from the coast of Kittim” Rav says: the Roman legion [ libbun aspir ] “And they shall afflict Assyria, and they shall afflict Eber” Before Assyria they will kill from that forward they will enslave them
llm_translation: "And flax from the hand of the Kittim," Rav Libbon said, "I will recount and they shall afflict Assyria, and they shall afflict Eber, until Assyria is destroyed. From here and onwards, they shall serve servitude."

hebrew_text: הִנְנִי הוֹלֵךְ לְעַמִּי לְכָה אִיעָצְךָ אֲשֶׁר יַעֲשֶׂה הָעָם הַזֶּה לְעַמְּךָ עַמְּךָ לְעָם הַזֶּה מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ אָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא בַּר כָּהֲנָא כְּאָדָם שֶׁמְּקַלֵּל אֶת עַצְמוֹ וְתוֹלֶה קִלְלָתוֹ בַּאֲחֵרִים
human_translation: “Behold, I go to my people; come therefore, and I shall advise you what this people shall do to your people” he should have your people to this people. Rabbi Abba bar Kahana says: like a person who curses himself and ascribes his curse to others.
llm_translation: Behold, I am going to my people; come, I will advise you what this people will do to your people in the future. Your people to this people, this people to your people. Why does he need it? Rabbi Abba bar Kahana said: Like a man who curses himself and hangs his curse on others.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָהֶם אֱלֹהֵיהֶם שֶׁל אֵלּוּ שׂוֹנֵא זִימָּה הוּא וְהֵם מִתְאַוִּים לִכְלֵי פִשְׁתָּן בּוֹא וְאַשִּׂיאֲךָ עֵצָה עֲשֵׂה לָהֶן קְלָעִים וְהוֹשֵׁיב בָּהֶן זוֹנוֹת זְקֵינָה מִבַּחוּץ וְיַלְדָּה מִבִּפְנִים וְיִמְכְּרוּ לָהֶן כְּלֵי פִשְׁתָּן
human_translation: said to them: The God of these despises lewdness, and they desire linen garments, come, and I will give you advice. Make for them hangings and seat prostitutes in them, an old woman outside and a young woman inside, and sell them linen garments.
llm_translation: He said to them, "Their God, who hates promiscuity, is the one they desire to make linen garments. Come and I will advise you: Make for them curtains, and place in them an elderly prostitute from outside and a young girl from inside, and sell them linen garments."

hebrew_text: עָשָׂה לָהֶן קְלָעִים מֵהַר שֶׁלֶג עַד בֵּית הַיְשִׁימוֹת וְהוֹשִׁיב בָּהֶן זוֹנוֹת זְקֵינָה מִבַּחוּץ וְיַלְדָּה מִבִּפְנִים וּבְשָׁעָה שֶׁיִּשְׂרָאֵל אוֹכְלִין וְשׁוֹתִין וּשְׂמֵחִין וְיוֹצְאִין לְטַיֵּיל בְּשׁוּק אוֹמֶרֶת לוֹ הַזְּקֵינָה אִי אַתָּה מְבַקֵּשׁ כְּלֵי פִשְׁתָּן זְקֵינָה אוֹמֶרֶת לוֹ בְּשָׁוֶה וְיַלְדָּה אוֹמֶרֶת לוֹ בְּפָחוֹת שְׁתַּיִם וְשָׁלֹשׁ פְּעָמִים
human_translation: made for them hangings from the snow mountain, until Beit HaYeshimot, and he sat prostitutes in them, an old woman outside and a young woman on the inside. And at the time when Jewish people were eating and drinking and were glad and going out to stroll in the marketplace, the old woman would say to Aren’t you seeking linen garments? the old woman would quote him equal and the young woman would quote him less two or three times.
llm_translation: He made for them curtains from snow mountain until Beit HaYeshimot and placed in them an elderly prostitute from outside and a young girl from inside. And at the time when the Israelites eat, drink, rejoice, and go out to stroll in the market, the elderly woman says to him, "Are you seeking linen garments?" The elderly woman says to him, "In exchange." And the young girl says to him, "For less, two or three times."

hebrew_text: וְאַחַר כָּךְ אוֹמֶרֶת לוֹ הֲרֵי אַתְּ כְּבֶן בַּיִת שֵׁב בְּרוֹר לְעַצְמְךָ וְצַרְצוּרי שֶׁל יַיִן עַמּוֹנִי מוּנָּח אֶצְלָהּ וַעֲדַיִין לֹא נֶאֱסַר יַיִן שֶׁל עַמּוֹנִי וְלֹא יַיִן שֶׁל גּוֹיִם אָמְרָה לוֹ רְצוֹנֶךָ שֶׁתִּשְׁתֶּה כּוֹס שֶׁל יַיִן כֵּיוָן שֶׁשָּׁתָה בָּעַר בּוֹ
human_translation: And thereafter she would say to him: You are like a member of our household, sit choose for yourself And a jug of Ammonite wine was placed near her, and Ammonite wine nor gentile wine had been prohibited yet She said to him: Is it your wish to drink a cup of wine? Once he drank burned within him.
llm_translation: And after that she says to him, "Behold, you are like a son of the household, sit comfortably by yourself, and a goblet of Ammonite wine is placed before her, and still Ammonite wine is not prohibited, nor wine of the nations." She said to him, "It is your will that you drink a cup of wine, once he drank, he burned in it."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לָהּ הִשָּׁמֵיעִי לִי הוֹצִיאָה יִרְאָתָהּ מִתּוֹךְ חֵיקָהּ אָמְרָה לוֹ עֲבוֹד לָזֶה אֲמַר לָהּ הֲלֹא יְהוּדִי אֲנִי אָמְרָה לוֹ וּמָה אִיכְפַּת לְךָ כְּלוּם מְבַקְּשִׁים מִמְּךָ אֶלָּא פִּיעוּר [וְהוּא אֵינוֹ יוֹדֵעַ שֶׁעֲבוֹדָתָהּ בְּכָךְ] וְלֹא עוֹד אֶלָּא שֶׁאֵינִי מַנַּחְתְּךָ עַד שֶׁתִּכְפּוֹר בְּתוֹרַת מֹשֶׁה רַבְּךָ שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר 'הֵמָּה בָּאוּ בַּעַל פְּעוֹר וַיִּנָּזְרוּ לַבֹּשֶׁת וַיִּהְיוּ שִׁקּוּצִים
human_translation: He said to her: Submit to me She removed idol she worshipped from her lap and said to him: Worship this. He said to her: Am I not Jewish? She said to him: And what is your concern? We are asking you to do nothing more than defecate But he does not know that its worship in that Moreover, I will not leave you until you deny the Torah of Moses your teacher, as it is stated: “But when they came to Ba’al-Peor they separated themselves to the shameful item; and they became detestable like that which they loved”
llm_translation: He said to her, "Inform me, bring forth her fear from within her bosom." She said to him, "Serve for this." He said to her, "Am I not a Jew?" She said to him, "And why do you care? We seek nothing from you except for appeasement and he does not know that her service is in this way. And not only that, but I will not leave you until you are atoned in the Torah of your master Moses, as it is said, 'They came to Baal Peor and separated themselves for shame, and they became abominations.'"

hebrew_text: וַיֵּשֶׁב יִשְׂרָאֵל בַּשִּׁטִּים רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר שִׁטִּים שְׁמָהּ רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר שֶׁנִּתְעַסְקוּ בְּדִבְרֵי שְׁטוּת
human_translation: “And Israel dwelt in Shittim” Rabbi Eliezer says: Shittim the name of Rabbi Yehoshua says: that they were engaged in matters of nonsense [ shetut ],
llm_translation: Israel dwelt in Shittim. Rabbi Eliezer says: Shittim is its name. Rabbi Yehoshua says: They engaged in matters of foolishness.

hebrew_text: וַתִּקְרֶאןָ לָעָם לְזִבְחֵי אֱלֹהֵיהֶן רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר עֲרוּמּוֹת פָּגְעוּ בָּהֶן רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר שֶׁנַּעֲשׂוּ כּוּלָּן בַּעֲלֵי קְרָיִין
human_translation: “And they called [ vatikrena ] the people to the offerings of their gods” Rabbi Eliezer says: Naked women encountered them. Rabbi Yehoshua says: They all became those who experienced a seminal emission [ kerayin ]
llm_translation: And they called to the people for the sacrifices of their gods. Rabbi Eliezer says: Naked ones encountered them. Rabbi Yehoshua says: They all became owners of a bald spot.

hebrew_text: מַאי לְשׁוֹן רְפִידִים רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר רְפִידִים שְׁמָהּ רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר שֶׁרִיפּוּ עַצְמָן מִדִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה  שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר לֹא הִפְנוּ אָבוֹת אֶל בָּנִים מֵרִפְיוֹן יָדָיִם
human_translation: What term Rephidim Rabbi Eliezer says: Rephidim the name of Rabbi Yehoshua says: that they enfeebled [ rippu ] themselves with regard to matters of Torah, as it is stated: “The fathers do not look back to their children from feebleness [ rifyon ] of hands”
llm_translation: What is the meaning of "refidim"? Rabbi Eliezer says: "Refidim is its name." Rabbi Yehoshua says: "They weakened themselves from the words of the Torah," as it is said, "The fathers did not turn to the children from the weakening of their hands."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וַיֵּשֶׁב אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא לְשׁוֹן צַעַר שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וַיֵּשֶׁב יִשְׂרָאֵל בַּשִּׁטִּים וַיָּחֶל הָעָם לִזְנוֹת אֶל בְּנוֹת מוֹאָב וַיֵּשֶׁב יַעֲקֹב בְּאֶרֶץ מְגוּרֵי אָבִיו בְּאֶרֶץ כְּנָעַן וַיָּבֵא יוֹסֵף אֶת דִּבָּתָם רָעָה אֶל אֲבִיהֶם וְנֶאֱמַר וַיֵּשֶׁב יִשְׂרָאֵל בְּאֶרֶץ גֹּשֶׁן וַיִּקְרְבוּ יְמֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל לָמוּת וַיֵּשֶׁב יְהוּדָה וְיִשְׂרָאֵל לָבֶטַח אִישׁ תַּחַת גַּפְנוֹ וְתַחַת תְּאֵנָתוֹ וַיָּקֶם ה' שָׂטָן לִשְׁלֹמֹה אֵת הֲדַד הָאֲדֹמִי מִזֶּרַע הַמֶּלֶךְ הוּא בֶּאֱדוֹם
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Everywhere that it is stated: And he dwelt, it is nothing other than an expression of pain, as it is stated: “And Israel dwelt in Shittim, and the people began to commit harlotry with the daughters of Moab” “And Jacob dwelt in the land where his father had sojourned in the land of Canaan” “And Joseph brought evil report of them to his father” And it is stated: “And Israel dwelt in the land of Goshen” “And the time drew near that Israel was to die” “And Judah and Israel dwelt safely, every man under his vine and under his fig tree” “And the Lord raised up an adversary to Solomon, Hadad the Edomite; he was of the king’s seed in Edom”
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: Every place where it says "and he dwelt" is only an expression of distress, as it says, "And Israel dwelt in Shittim, and the people began to commit harlotry with the daughters of Moab." And Jacob dwelt in the land of his father's sojournings, in the land of Canaan. And Joseph brought their evil report to their father. And it says, "And Israel dwelt in the land of Goshen, and the days of Israel drew near to die." And Judah and Israel dwelt securely, every man under his vine and under his fig tree. And the Lord raised up an adversary to Solomon, Hadad the Edomite, from the seed of the king, he was in Edom.

hebrew_text: וְאֶת מַלְכֵי מִדְיָן הָרְגוּ עַל חַלְלֵיהֶם וְגוֹ' וְאֶת בִּלְעָם בֶּן בְּעוֹר הָרְגוּ בֶּחָרֶב בִּלְעָם מַאי בָּעֵי הָתָם אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן שֶׁהָלַךְ לִיטּוֹל שְׂכַר עֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבָּעָה אֶלֶף [שֶׁהִפִּיל מִיִּשְׂרָאֵל] אָמַר מָר זוּטְרָא בַּר טוֹבִיָּה אָמַר רַב הַיְינוּ דְּאָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי גַּמְלָא אֲזַלָא לְמִיבְעֵי קַרְנֵי אוּדְנֵי דַּהֲווֹ לֵיהּ גְּזִיזָן מִינֵּיהּ
human_translation: “And they slew the kings of Midian, with the rest of their slain…And Balaam, son of Beor, they slew with the sword” Balaam, what did he seek there; Rabbi Yoḥanan says: He went to collect payment for twenty-four thousand of the Jewish people, whom he felled Mar Zutra bar Toviya says Rav says this that people say: A camel goes to seek horns the ears that it had are severed from it.
llm_translation: "And the kings of Midian they killed upon their slain, etc." (Numbers 31:8) "And they killed Balaam son of Beor with the sword." What did Balaam seek there? Rabbi Yochanan said: He went to receive his reward of twenty-four thousand that he caused to fall from Israel. Mar Zutra son of Tobiah said: Rav said: This is like what people say, 'A camel driver went to collect the horns of the camels that were left by him.'"

hebrew_text: וְאֶת בִּלְעָם בֶּן בְּעוֹר הַקּוֹסֵם קוֹסֵם נָבִיא הוּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בַּתְּחִלָּה נָבִיא וּלְבַסּוֹף קוֹסֵם אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא הַיְינוּ דְּאָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי מִסְּגָנֵי וְשִׁילְטִי הֲוַאי אִיַּיזַן לְגַבְרֵי נַגָּרֵי
human_translation: “And Balaam, son of Beor, the diviner, a diviner? He is a prophet. Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Initially a prophet, but ultimately, a diviner. Rav Pappa says this that people say: was from princes and rulers, was licentious with carpenters.
llm_translation: And Bilam son of Beor the diviner, diviner prophet he is. Said Rabbi Yochanan: Initially a prophet, and in the end a diviner. Said Rav Papa: This is what people say, "From the officials and the governors, where are they to the men of the tannery?"

hebrew_text: הָרְגוּ בְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל [בַּחֶרֶב] אֶל חַלְלֵיהֶם אָמַר רַב שֶׁקִּיְּימוּ בּוֹ אַרְבַּע מִיתוֹת סְקִילָה וּשְׂרֵיפָה הֶרֶג וָחֶנֶק
human_translation: did the children of Israel slay with the sword among the rest of their slain” Rav says: that they accomplished in him four executions: Stoning, and burning, beheading, and strangulation.
llm_translation: They killed the children of Israel with the sword, regarding their slain ones, Rav said: they are liable for four death penalties - stoning, burning, slaying, and strangulation.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ הָהוּא מִינָא לְרַבִּי חֲנִינָא מִי שְׁמִיעַ לָךְ בִּלְעָם בַּר כַּמָּה הֲוָה אֲמַר לֵיהּ מִיכְתָּב לָא כְּתִיב אֶלָּא מִדִּכְתִיב 'אַנְשֵׁי דָמִים וּמִרְמָה לֹא יֶחֱצוּ יְמֵיהֶם' בַּר תְּלָתִין וּתְלָת שְׁנִין אוֹ בַּר תְּלָתִין וְאַרְבַּע אֲמַר לֵיהּ שַׁפִּיר קָאָמְרַתְּ לְדִידִי חֲזֵי לִי פִּנְקָסֵיהּ דְּבִלְעָם וַהֲוָה כְּתִיב בֵּיהּ 'בַּר תְּלָתִין וּתְלָת שְׁנִין בִּלְעָם חֲגִירָא כַּד קָטֵיל יָתֵיהּ פִּנְחָס לִיסְטָאָה'
human_translation: A certain heretic said to Rabbi Ḥanina: Have you heard how old Balaam was said to him: It is not written But from that it is written: “Bloody and deceitful men shall not live half their days” thirty-three or thirty-four years old, said to him: You have spoken well, I myself saw the notebook of Balaam and it was written therein: Balaam the lame was thirty-three years old when Pinehas the highwayman killed him.
llm_translation: He said to him: That heretic said to Rabbi Chanina, "How many times is Balaam mentioned in the Torah?" He said to him, "It is not written explicitly, but from what is written, 'Men of bloodshed and deceit shall not live out half their days,' either thirty-three years or thirty-four." He said to him, "You have spoken well according to my opinion. Look at the genealogy of Balaam, where it is written about him, 'Balaam the son of Beor, the soothsayer, was killed by the sword; and Pinchas, the son of Elazar, was zealous for his God.'"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ מָר בְּרֵיהּ דְּרָבִינָא לִבְרֵיהּ בְּכוּלְּהוּ לָא תַּפֵּישׁ לְמִדְרַשׁ לְבַר מִבִּלְעָם הָרָשָׁע דְּכַמָּה דְּמַשְׁכַּחַתְּ בֵּיהּ דְּרוֹשׁ בֵּיהּ
human_translation: Mar, son of Ravina, said to his son: all of those do not extensively interpret homiletically except Balaam the wicked, as any that you discover in his interpret homiletically concerning him,
llm_translation: He said to him, the master, son of Ravina, to his son, in all of them, you should not be occupied with the Midrash on the son of Beor, the wicked, as much as you find in it, seek in it.

hebrew_text: כְּתִיב דּוֹאֵג וּכְתִיב דּוֹיֵיג אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בַּתְּחִילָּה יוֹשֵׁב הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא וְדוֹאֵג שֶׁמָּא יֵצֵא זֶה לְתַרְבּוּת רָעָה לְאַחַר שֶׁיָּצָא אָמַר וַוי שֶׁיָּצָא זֶה
human_translation: It is written “Doeg and it is written Doyeig” Rabbi Yoḥanan says Initially, the Holy One, Blessed be He, sat and was concerned [ doeg ] perhaps this would emerge to an evil path. After he emerged said: Alas [ vai ], that has emerged to
llm_translation: It is written "Doeg" and it is written "Doyeg." Rabbi Yochanan said: Initially, the Holy One, blessed be He, was sitting and worrying lest this one Doeg would go out to evil behavior. After he went out, He said, "Woe that this one went out."

hebrew_text: (סִימָן גִּבּוֹר רָשָׁע וְצַדִּיק חַיִל וְסוֹפֵר)
human_translation: a mnemonic Mighty, wicked, and righteous, riches, and counter.
llm_translation: Chapter: A mighty wicked person, a righteous person of valor, and a scribe.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק מַאי דִּכְתִיב מַה תִּתְהַלֵּל בְּרָעָה הַגִּבּוֹר חֶסֶד אֵל כׇּל הַיּוֹם  אָמַר לוֹ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לְדוֹאֵג לֹא גִּבּוֹר בַּתּוֹרָה אַתָּה מַה תִּתְהַלֵּל בְּרָעָה לֹא חֶסֶד אֵל נָטוּי עָלֶיךָ כׇּל הַיּוֹם
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzḥak says: What which is written: “Why boast of your evil mighty one? The mercy of God endures continually” The Holy One, Blessed be He, said to Doeg: Aren’t you mighty in Torah? Why do you boast of evil? Isn’t God’s mercy extended over you continually
llm_translation: Rabbi Yitzchak said: What is the meaning of what is written, "Why do you boast of evil, O mighty man? The kindness of God is all day long." The Holy One, blessed be He, said to Doeg: You do not boast in Torah, you mighty man. Why do you boast of evil? The kindness of God is upon you all day long.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק מַאי דִּכְתִיב וְלָרָשָׁע אָמַר אֱלֹהִים מַה לְּךָ לְסַפֵּר חֻקָּי אָמַר לוֹ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לְדוֹאֵג הָרָשָׁע מַה לְּךָ לְסַפֵּר חֻקָּי כְּשֶׁאַתָּה מַגִּיעַ לְפָרָשַׁת מְרַצְּחִים וּפָרָשַׁת מְסַפְּרֵי לָשׁוֹן הָרָע מָה אַתָּה דּוֹרֵשׁ בָּהֶם וַתִּשָּׂא בְרִיתִי עֲלֵי פִיךָ אָמַר רַבִּי אַמֵּי אֵין תּוֹרָתוֹ שֶׁל דּוֹאֵג אֶלָּא מִשָּׂפָה וְלַחוּץ
human_translation: And Rabbi Yitzḥak says: What which is written: “But to the wicked, God says: What have you to do to declare My statutes, The Holy One, Blessed be He, said to Doeg the wicked: Why do you speak of My statutes When you reach portion of murderers and portion of slanderers, how do you teach them? “And that you have taken My covenant in your mouth” Rabbi Ami says: Doeg’s Torah is only lip service,
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yitzchak said: What is the meaning of what is written, "And to the wicked, God says: What right have you to recite My statutes?" (Psalms 50:16) The Holy One, blessed be He, said to the wicked: What right do you have to recite My statutes when you come to the portion of those who shed blood and the portion of those who speak evil? What do you seek in them, that you should take My covenant upon your lips? Rabbi Ammi said: The Torah of the wicked is only from the lips outward.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק מַאי דִּכְתִיב וְיִרְאוּ צַדִּיקִים וְיִירָאוּ וְעָלָיו יִשְׂחָקוּ  בַּתְּחִילָּה יִירָאוּ וּלְבַסּוֹף יִשְׂחָקוּ
human_translation: And Rabbi Yitzḥak says: What which is written: “And the righteous shall see, and fear, and shall laugh at him” Initially, they will fear and ultimately they will laugh
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yitzchak said: What is the meaning of what is written, "Let the righteous fear and rejoice, and let them be glad in Him"? Initially, let them fear, and ultimately let them rejoice.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק מַאי דִּכְתִיב חַיִל בָּלַע וַיְקִאֶנּוּ מִבִּטְנוֹ יוֹרִישֶׁנּוּ אֵל  אָמַר דָּוִד לִפְנֵי הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם יָמוּת דּוֹאֵג אָמַר לוֹ חַיִל בָּלַע וַיְקִיאֶנּוּ אָמַר לְפָנָיו מִבִּטְנוֹ יוֹרִישֶׁנּוּ אֵל
human_translation: And Rabbi Yitzḥak says: What which is written: “He has swallowed riches and he shall vomit them again; God shall cast them out of his belly” David said before the Holy One, Blessed be He: Master of the Universe, Doeg shall die. said to him: “He has swallowed riches and he shall vomit them again.” said before Him: “God shall cast them out of his belly.”
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yitzchak said: What is the meaning of the verse, "He swallowed wealth but will vomit it out; God will force it from his stomach"? David said before the Holy One, blessed be He: "May the Master of the world cause him to die in his worry." He said to him: "He swallowed wealth but will vomit it out." He said before Him: "God will force it from his stomach."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק מַאי דִּכְתִיב גַּם אֵל יִתׇּצְךָ לָנֶצַח  אָמַר הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לְדָוִד נֵיתֵי דּוֹאֵג לְעָלְמָא דְּאָתֵי אָמַר לְפָנָיו גַּם אֵל יִתׇּצְךָ לָנֶצַח מַאי דִּכְתִיב יַחְתְּךָ וְיִסָּחֲךָ מֵאֹהֶל וְשֵׁרֶשְׁךָ מֵאֶרֶץ חַיִּים סֶלָה  אָמַר הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לֵימְרוּ שְׁמַעְתָּא בֵּי מִדְרְשָׁא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ אָמַר לְפָנָיו יַחְתְּךָ וְיִסָּחֲךָ מֵאֹהֶל לֶיהֱוֵי לֵיהּ בְּנִין רַבָּנַן וְשֵׁרֶשְׁךָ מֵאֶרֶץ חַיִּים סֶלָה
human_translation: And Rabbi Yitzḥak says: What which is written: “God shall likewise destroy you forever” The Holy One, Blessed be He, said to David: Let Doeg enter the World-to-Come. said before Him: “God shall likewise destroy you forever,” What which is written: “He shall pluck you away, and pluck you from your tent, and root you out from the land of the living. Selah” The Holy One, Blessed be He, said let them state a halakha in the study hall in his name. said before Him: “He shall pluck you away, and pluck you from your tent,” Let him have sons who are Sages. “And root you out from the land of the living. Selah,”
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yitzchak said, what is the meaning of what is written, "Even God will shatter you forever"? The Holy One, blessed be He, said to David: Be concerned for the world that is to come. He said before Him: "Even God will shatter you forever." What is the meaning of what is written, "He will uproot you and drive you out of the tent, and your roots from the land of the living, Selah"? The Holy One, blessed be He, said: Let the scholars say from My name in the study hall: "He will uproot you and drive you out of the tent" – let it be for the building of the scholars, "and your roots from the land of the living, Selah."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק מַאי דִּכְתִיב אַיֵּה סֹפֵר אַיֵּה שֹׁקֵל אַיֵּה סֹפֵר אֶת הַמִּגְדָּלִים אַיֵּה סֹפֵר כׇּל אוֹתִיּוֹת שֶׁבַּתּוֹרָה אַיֵּה שֹׁקֵל שֶׁשּׁוֹקֵל כָּל קַלִּים וַחֲמוּרִים שֶׁבַּתּוֹרָה אַיֵּה סֹפֵר אֶת הַמִּגְדָּלִים שֶׁהָיָה סוֹפֵר שְׁלֹשׁ מֵאוֹת הֲלָכוֹת פְּסוּקוֹת בְּמִגְדָּל הַפּוֹרֵחַ בָּאֲוִיר
human_translation: And Rabbi Yitzḥak says: What which is written: “Where is he that counts; where is he that weighs; where is he that counts the towers [ migdalim ]” Where is he that counts all the letters of the Torah? Where is he that weighs, who considers all the a fortiori inferences in the Torah? Where is he who counts the towers? who would count three hundred halakhic conclusions with regard to a cupboard [ migdal ] that floats in the air [ avir ].
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yitzchak said: What is the meaning of that which is written, "Where is the scribe, where is the weigher, where is the one who counts the towers?" Where is the scribe who counts all the letters in the Torah? Where is the weigher who weighs all the light and heavy matters in the Torah? Where is the scribe of the towers, who used to count three hundred halachot in the tower that flies in the air?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אַרְבַּע מְאָה בַּעְיֵי בְּעוֹ דּוֹאֵג וַאֲחִיתוֹפֶל בְּמִגְדָּל הַפּוֹרֵחַ בָּאֲוִיר (וְלָא אִיפְּשַׁט לְהוּ חַד) אָמַר רָבָא רְבוּתָא לְמִבְעֵי בַּעְיֵי בִּשְׁנֵי דְּרַב יְהוּדָה כּוּלֵּי תַּנּוֹיֵי בִּנְזִיקִין וַאֲנַן קָא מַתְנֵינַן טוּבָא בְּעוּקְצִין
human_translation: Rabbi says: Doeg and Ahithophel raised four hundred dilemmas with regard to a cupboard that floats in the air, and they did not resolve one, Rava says: greatness to raise dilemmas? in the years of Rav Yehuda all of their study Nezikin , and we study much in Okatzin ,
llm_translation: Rabbi said: Four hundred barrels of wine were needed for Doeg and Ahitophel in the tower that was suspended in the air (and one did not suffice for them). Rava said: The majority of barrels are needed for the two of Rav Yehudah, all for damages, and we are dealing with a good quality in the case of thorns.

hebrew_text: וְכִי הֲוָה מָטֵי רַב יְהוּדָה אִשָּׁה שֶׁכּוֹבֶשֶׁת יָרָק בִּקְדֵירָה וְאָמְרִי לַהּ זֵיתִים שֶׁכְּבָשָׁן בְּטַרְפֵיהֶן טְהוֹרִים אָמַר הֲוָיוֹת דְּרַב וּשְׁמוּאֵל קָא חָזֵינָא הָכָא וַאֲנַן קָא מַתְנֵינַן בְּעוּקְצִין תְּלָת סְרֵי מְתִיבָתָא
human_translation: Moreover, when Rav Yehuda would encounter a woman who pickles a vegetable in a pot, and some say Olives pickled with their leaves are pure, He would say: the discussions between Rav and Shmuel that we see here. And we, teach Okatzin in thirteen academies.
llm_translation: And when Rav Yehudah would come, a woman who was cooking vegetables in a pot, and they said to her, olives that were cooked in their torn state are pure, he said, "It was the case of Rav and Shmuel that we saw here, and we are teaching here in the case of three thorns."

hebrew_text: וְרַב יְהוּדָה שָׁלֵיף מְסָאנֵי וְאָתֵי מִטְרָא וַאֲנַן צָוְחִינַן וְלֵיכָּא דְּמַשְׁגַּח בַּן אֶלָּא הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לִיבָּא בָּעֵי דִּכְתִיב וַה' יִרְאֶה לַלֵּבָב
human_translation: But when Rav Yehuda would remove one of his shoes the rain would fall, we cry out and no one notices us. Rather, the Holy One, Blessed be He, seeks the heart, as it is written: “But the Lord looks on the heart”
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah takes out a knife and comes to cut, and we shout, but the Holy One, blessed be He, pays attention, as it is written, "And the Lord looks at the heart."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב מְשַׁרְשְׁיָא דּוֹאֵג וַאֲחִיתוֹפֶל לָא [הֲווֹ] סָבְרִי שְׁמַעְתָּא מַתְקֵיף לַהּ מָר זוּטְרָא מַאן דִּכְתִיב בֵּיהּ אַיֵּה סֹפֵר אַיֵּה שֹׁקֵל אַיֵּה סֹפֵר אֶת הַמִּגְדָּלִים וְאַתְּ אָמְרַתְּ לָא הֲווֹ סָבְרִי שְׁמַעְתָּא אֶלָּא דְּלָא הֲוָה סָלְקָא לְהוּ שְׁמַעְתָּא אַלִּיבָּא דְהִלְכְתָא דִּכְתִיב סוֹד ה' לִירֵאָיו
human_translation: Rav Mesharshiyya says: Doeg and Ahithophel did not comprehend halakhic discussions. Mar Zutra objects to this with regard to whom it is written: “Where is he that counts; where is he that weighs; where is he that counts the towers” and you say they did not comprehend halakhic discussions? Rather, would not conclude halakhic discussions in accordance with halakhic as it is written: “The secret of the Lord is with those who fear Him”
llm_translation: Rav Mesharshaya said: Doeg and Ahitophel did not think that the Master would challenge them. Who is the one written about: "Where is the scribe, where is the weigher, where is the one who counts the towers?" But you say they did not think that the Master would challenge them, except that the matter of the verse is in accordance with the verse written: "The secret of the Lord is for those who fear Him."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אַמֵּי לֹא מֵת דּוֹאֵג עַד שֶׁשָּׁכַח תַּלְמוּדוֹ שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר הוּא יָמוּת בְּאֵין מוּסָר וּבְרֹב אִוַּלְתּוֹ יִשְׁגֶּה רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר נִצְטָרַע שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר הִצְמַתָּה כׇּל זוֹנֶה מִמֶּךָּ
human_translation: Rabbi Ami says: Doeg died only when he forgot what he learned, as it is stated: “He shall die for want of instruction, and in his folly he shall go astray” Rav Ashi says: He was afflicted with leprosy as it is stated: “Those that go far from You shall perish; You destroy [ hitzmatta ] all those who go astray from You”
llm_translation: Rabbi Ammi said: Doeg did not die until he forgot his learning, as it is stated, "He shall die without instruction, and in the greatness of his folly he shall go astray." Rav Ashe said: He was afflicted with leprosy, as it is stated, "You have silenced all the prostitutes from you."

hebrew_text: כְּתִיב הָתָם לַצְּמִתֻת וּמְתַרְגְּמִינַן לַחֲלוּטִין וּתְנַן אֵין בֵּין מוּסְגָּר וּמוּחְלָט אֶלָּא פְּרִיעָה וּפְרִימָה
human_translation: It is written there: in perpetuity [ litzmitut ]” and we translate Laḥalutin . And we learned The difference between a quarantined and a confirmed [ muḥlat ] is only letting grow and rending
llm_translation: It is written there "for cutting off," and we interpret it as "for peeling," and we learned: There is no difference between "closed" and "peeled" except for "Pri'ah" and "Perimah."

hebrew_text: (סִימָן שְׁלֹשָׁה רָאוּ וְחָצוּ וְקָרְאוּ)
human_translation: a mnemonic Three, saw, and half, and called him.
llm_translation: Chapter Three: They saw, divided, and read.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן שְׁלֹשָׁה מַלְאֲכֵי חַבָּלָה נִזְדַּמְּנוּ לוֹ לְדוֹאֵג אֶחָד שֶׁשִּׁכַּח תַּלְמוּדוֹ וְאֶחָד שֶׁשָּׂרַף נִשְׁמָתוֹ וְאֶחָד שֶׁפִּיזֵּר עֲפָרוֹ בְּבָתֵּי כְנֵסִיּוֹת וּבְבָתֵּי מִדְרָשׁוֹת
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Three angels of destruction encountered Doeg: One who caused him to forget his Torah one who burned his soul, and one who dispersed the ashes of in synagogues and in study halls
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: Three ministering angels encountered Doeg: one who forgot his learning, one whose soul was burned, and one who scattered his dust in synagogues and study halls.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן דּוֹאֵג וַאֲחִיתוֹפֶל לֹא רָאוּ זֶה אֶת זֶה דּוֹאֵג בִּימֵי שָׁאוּל וַאֲחִיתוֹפֶל בִּימֵי דָּוִד
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Doeg and Ahithophel did not see one another, Doeg in the days of Saul, and Ahithophel in the days of David,
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yochanan: Doeg and Ahitophel did not see each other; Doeg in the days of Saul, and Ahitophel in the days of David.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן דּוֹאֵג וַאֲחִיתוֹפֶל לֹא חָצוּ יְמֵיהֶם תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי 'אַנְשֵׁי דָמִים וּמִרְמָה לֹא יֶחֱצוּ יְמֵיהֶם' כׇּל שְׁנוֹתָיו שֶׁל דּוֹאֵג לֹא הָיוּ אֶלָּא שְׁלֹשִׁים וְאַרְבַּע וְשֶׁל אֲחִיתוֹפֶל אֵינָן אֶלָּא שְׁלֹשִׁים וְשָׁלֹשׁ
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Doeg and Ahithophel did not reach half of their days, This is also taught “Bloody and deceitful men shall not live half their days” all the years of Doeg were only thirty-four, and of Ahithophel were only thirty-three.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yochanan said: Doeg and Ahitophel did not divide their days. It was taught in a baraita similarly: "Men of blood and deceit will not live out half their days." All the years of Doeg were only thirty-four, and those of Ahitophel were only thirty-three.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בַּתְּחִלָּה קָרָא דָּוִד לַאֲחִיתוֹפֶל רַבּוֹ וּלְבַסּוֹף קְרָאוֹ חֲבֵירוֹ וּלְבַסּוֹף קְרָאוֹ תַּלְמִידוֹ בַּתְּחִלָּה קְרָאוֹ רַבּוֹ וְאַתָּה אֱנוֹשׁ כְּעֶרְכִּי אַלּוּפִי וּמְיֻדָּעִי וּלְבַסּוֹף קְרָאוֹ חֲבֵרוֹ אֲשֶׁר יַחְדָּו נַמְתִּיק סוֹד בְּבֵית אֱלֹהִים נְהַלֵּךְ בְּרָגֶשׁ וּלְבַסּוֹף קְרָאוֹ תַּלְמִידוֹ גַּם אִישׁ שְׁלוֹמִי אֲשֶׁר בָּטַחְתִּי בוֹ
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Initially, David called Ahithophel his teacher, and eventually, he called him his colleague, and ultimately, he called him his student. Initially, called his teacher, “But it was you, a man my equal, my master [ alufi ], and my familiar friend” And eventually, he called him his colleague, “We took sweet counsel together, and walked to the house of God with the throng” And ultimately, he called him his student, “Even my own familiar friend, in whom I trusted,
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yochanan said: At first, David called Ahitophel his teacher, and in the end, he called him his colleague. At first, he called him his teacher, and you, O man, according to my estimation, were my superior and my familiar, and in the end, he called him his colleague, with whom I sweetened counsel in the house of God; we walked with emotion. And in the end, he called him his disciple, even Shlomi, in whom I trusted.

hebrew_text: אוֹכֵל לַחְמִי הִגְדִּיל עָלַי עָקֵב
human_translation: who did eat of my bread, has lifted his heel against me”
llm_translation: "Eating my bread, he has magnified against me a heel."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב לְעוֹלָם אַל יָבִיא אָדָם עַצְמוֹ לִידֵי נִסָּיוֹן שֶׁהֲרֵי דָּוִד מֶלֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵל הֵבִיא עַצְמוֹ לִידֵי נִסָּיוֹן וְנִכְשָׁל אָמַר לְפָנָיו רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם מִפְּנֵי מָה אוֹמְרִים 'אֱלֹהֵי אַבְרָהָם אֱלֹהֵי יִצְחָק וֵאלֹהֵי יַעֲקֹב' וְאֵין אוֹמְרִים 'אֱלֹהֵי דָוִד' אָמַר אִינְהוּ מִינְּסוּ לִי וְאַתְּ לָא מִינַּסֵּית לִי אָמַר לְפָנָיו רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם בְּחָנֵנִי וְנַסֵּנִי שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר 'בְּחָנֵנִי ה' וְנַסֵּנִי' וְגוֹ'
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Rav says: A person should never bring himself to an ordeal, as David, king of Israel, brought himself to an ordeal and failed. said before Master of the Universe, for what does one say God of Abraham, God of Isaac, and God of Jacob, and one does not say: God of David? said They have undergone ordeals before Me, and you have not undergone an ordeal before Me. said before Him: Examine me and subject me to an ordeal, as it is stated: “Examine me, Lord, and subject me to an ordeal;
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: A person should never bring himself to a situation of temptation, for behold, King David of Israel brought himself to a situation of temptation and stumbled. He said before the Holy One, blessed be He: Master of the Universe, why do they say, "God of Abraham, God of Isaac, and God of Jacob," and they do not say, "God of David"? He said to him: They tested me, but you did not test me. He said before the Holy One, blessed be He: Master of the Universe, test me and try me, as it is said, "Test me, O Lord, and try me" (Psalms 26:2) and so on.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר מְינַסֵּינָא לָךְ וְעָבֵידְנָא מִילְּתָא בַּהֲדָךְ דִּלְדִידְהוּ לָא הוֹדַעְתִּינְהוּ וְאִילּוּ אֲנָא קָא מוֹדַעְנָא לָךְ דִּמְנַסֵּינָא לָךְ בִּדְבַר עֶרְוָה מִיָּד וַיְהִי לְעֵת הָעֶרֶב וַיָּקׇם דָּוִד מֵעַל מִשְׁכָּבוֹ וְגוֹ'
human_translation: said I will subject you to an ordeal, and I will perform a matter for you as for them, I did not inform them while I am informing you that I will subject you to an ordeal involving a matter of relations forbidden. Immediately, “And it came to pass one evening that David rose from his bed”
llm_translation: I say to you, and we will do a matter together, that to them we did not inform it, and if I am informing you that I am fleeing from you in a matter of nakedness immediately, "And it came to pass in the evening, that David arose from his bed..." (2 Samuel 11:2)

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה שֶׁהָפַךְ מִשְׁכָּבוֹ שֶׁל לַיְלָה לְמִשְׁכָּבוֹ שֶׁל יוֹם וְנִתְעַלְּמָה מִמֶּנּוּ הֲלָכָה אֵבֶר קָטָן יֵשׁ בָּאָדָם מַשְׂבִּיעוֹ  רָעֵב וּמַרְעִיבוֹ  שָׂבֵעַ
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says: He transformed his nighttime bed into his daytime bed, But a halakha , escaped him: There is a small limb in man he starves is satiated; but he satiates is starving,
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said: If one turns his night bed into his day bed, and the law is hidden from him, there is a small limb in a person that satisfies him when he is hungry and makes him hungry when he is satisfied.

hebrew_text: וַיִּתְהַלֵּךְ עַל גַּג בֵּית הַמֶּלֶךְ וַיַּרְא אִשָּׁה רוֹחֶצֶת מֵעַל הַגָּג וְהָאִשָּׁה טוֹבַת מַרְאֶה מְאֹד בַּת שֶׁבַע הֲוָה קָא חָיְיפָא רֵישָׁא תּוּתֵי חַלְּתָא אֲתָא שָׂטָן אִידְּמִי לֵיהּ כְּצִיפַּרְתָּא פְּתַק בֵּיהּ גִּירָא פַּתְקַהּ לְחַלְּתָא אִיגַּלַּיה וְחַזְיַיהּ
human_translation: “And he walked upon the roof of the king’s house; from the roof he saw a woman bathing, and the woman was very fair to look upon” Bathsheba was shampooing her head behind a beehive, Satan came and appeared to as a bird. shot an arrow at severed the beehive, was exposed, and saw her.
llm_translation: And he walked upon the roof of the king's house, and he saw a woman bathing from the roof, and the woman was very good-looking. Bathsheba was her name. The evil inclination came and likened her to a beautiful bird. He sent an arrow at her, and he saw her.

hebrew_text: מִיָּד וַיִּשְׁלַח דָּוִד וַיִּדְרֹשׁ לָאִשָּׁה וַיֹּאמֶר הֲלוֹא זֹאת בַּת שֶׁבַע בַּת אֱלִיעָם אֵשֶׁת אוּרִיָּה הַחִתִּי וַיִּשְׁלַח דָּוִד מַלְאָכִים וַיִּקָּחֶהָ וַתָּבוֹא אֵלָיו וַיִּשְׁכַּב עִמָּהּ וְהִיא מִתְקַדֶּשֶׁת מִטֻּמְאָתָהּ וַתָּשׇׁב אֶל בֵּיתָהּ וְהַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב בָּחַנְתָּ לִבִּי פָּקַדְתָּ לַּיְלָה צְרַפְתַּנִי בַל תִּמְצָא זַמֹּתִי בַּל יַעֲבׇר פִּי אָמַר אִיכּוֹ זְמָמָא נְפַל בְּפוּמֵּיהּ דְּמַאן דְּסָנֵי לִי וְלָא אֲמַר כִּי הָא מִילְּתָא
human_translation: Immediately, “And David sent and inquired after the woman. And one said: Is not this Bathsheba, daughter of Eliam, the wife of Uriah the Hittite? And David sent messengers, and took her, and she came to him, and he lay with her, for she was purified from her impurity, and then she returned to her house” And that is which is written: “You have proved my heart; You have visited me in the night: You have tried me, but You find nothing; let no presumptuous thought pass my lips” said: Oh, that a muzzle would have fallen upon the mouth of the one who hates me, and I would not have said anything like that
llm_translation: Immediately David sent and inquired about the woman, and he said, "Is this not Bathsheba, the daughter of Eliam, the wife of Uriah the Hittite?" And David sent messengers and took her, and she came to him, and he lay with her, and she had purified herself from her impurity, and she returned to her house. This is as it is written, "You have tried my heart, You have visited me at night, You have refined me, but You will find nothing; my thoughts will not transgress my mouth." He said, "How can I cause this matter to fall into the hands of my enemies and not say anything?"

hebrew_text: דָּרֵשׁ רָבָא מַאי דִּכְתִיב לַמְנַצֵּחַ לְדָוִד בַּה' חָסִיתִי אֵיךְ תֹּאמְרוּ לְנַפְשִׁי נוּדִי הַרְכֶם צִפֹּר  אָמַר דָּוִד לִפְנֵי הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם מְחוֹל לִי עַל אוֹתוֹ עָוֹן שֶׁלֹּא יֹאמְרוּ 'הַר שֶׁבָּכֶם צִפּוֹר נִדְּדַתּוּ'
human_translation: Rava taught: What which is written: “To the leader, of David. In the Lord I put my trust; how can you say to my soul: Flee like a bird to your mountain” David said before the Holy One, Blessed be He: Master of the Universe, pardon me for that sin that will not say: The mountain that is among you, was driven a bird
llm_translation: Rava sought: What is the meaning of what is written, "For the conductor, of David, in Hashem I have taken refuge; how can you say to my soul, 'Flee like a bird to your mountain?'" David said before the Holy One, blessed be He: Master of the world, forgive me for that sin, so that they will not say, "The mountain in you, bird, has wandered away."

hebrew_text: דָּרֵשׁ רָבָא מַאי דִּכְתִיב לְךָ לְבַדְּךָ חָטָאתִי וְהָרַע בְּעֵינֶיךָ עָשִׂיתִי לְמַעַן תִּצְדַּק בְּדׇבְרֶךָ תִּזְכֶּה בְשׇׁפְטֶךָ  אָמַר דָּוִד לִפְנֵי הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא גַּלְיָא וִידִיעָא קַמָּךְ דְּאִי בְּעַאי לְמִכְפְּיֵיהּ לְיִצְרַי הֲוָה כָּיֵיפְינָא אֶלָּא אָמֵינָא דְּלָא לֵימְרוּ 'עַבְדָּא זַכְיֵ[הּ] לְמָרֵיהּ'
human_translation: Rava taught: What which is written: “Against You, only You, have I sinned, and done what is evil in Your eyes; that You are justified when You speak, and right when You judge” David said before the Holy One, Blessed be He: It is revealed and known before You that if I sought to suppress my inclination, I would have suppressed it; but I said: that they will not say a servant overcame his master
llm_translation: Rava sought: What is the meaning of what is written, "Against You, You alone, have I sinned, and what is evil in Your eyes, I have done, so that You are just in Your words, and pure in Your judgment"? David said before the Holy One, blessed be He: "Reveal and make known to me, if I were to ask to subdue my evil inclination, would I be able to?" Rather, I believe that they should not say, "A servant should merit his Master."

hebrew_text: דָּרֵשׁ רָבָא מַאי דִּכְתִיב כִּי אֲנִי לְצֶלַע נָכוֹן וּמַכְאוֹבִי נֶגְדִּי תָמִיד  רְאוּיָה הָיְתָה בַּת שֶׁבַע בַּת אֱלִיעָם לְדָוִד מִשֵּׁשֶׁת יְמֵי בְּרֵאשִׁית  אֶלָּא שֶׁבָּאת עָלָיו בְּמַכְאוֹב וְכֵן תָּנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל רְאוּיָה הָיְתָה לְדָוִד בַּת שֶׁבַע בַּת אֱלִיעָם אֶלָּא שֶׁאֲכָלָהּ פַּגָּה
human_translation: Rava taught: What which is written: “For I am ready to stumble [ letzela ] and my pain is always before me” Bathsheba, daughter of Eliam, was fit for David from the six days of Creation. But she came to him through pain. And likewise, the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: Bathsheba, daughter of Eliam, was fit for David, but he partook of her unripe,
llm_translation: Rava sought: What is the meaning of what is written, "For I am a ready to fall, and my pain is continually before me"? The daughter of Sheva, the daughter of Eliam, was fitting for David from the six days of creation, but she came upon him with pain. And so it was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael: The daughter of Sheva, the daughter of Eliam, was fitting for David, but she was defiled.

hebrew_text: דָּרֵשׁ רָבָא מַאי דִּכְתִיב וּבְצַלְעִי שָׂמְחוּ וְנֶאֱסָפוּ נֶאֶסְפוּ עָלַי נֵכִים [ וְלֹא יָדַעְתִּי] קָרְעוּ וְלֹא דָמּוּ  אָמַר דָּוִד לִפְנֵי הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם גָּלוּי וְיָדוּעַ לְפָנֶיךָ שֶׁאִם הָיוּ קוֹרְעִין בְּשָׂרִי לֹא הָיָה דָּמִי שׁוֹתֵת
human_translation: Rava taught: What which is written: “And when I limped they rejoiced and gathered, the wretched gather themselves together against me, and those whom I know not; they tore and did not cease [ dammu ]” David said before the Holy One, Blessed be He: Master of the Universe. It is revealed and known before you that if were to tear my flesh, my blood [ dami ] would not flow to the ground,
llm_translation: Rava sought: What is the meaning of what is written, "And in their side they rejoiced, and they were gathered together, even the wounded gathered against me, though I knew it not; they did tear me, and ceased not" (Job 30:25)? David said before the Holy One, blessed be He: Master of the universe, it is revealed and known before You that if they were tearing my flesh, my blood would not have ceased.

hebrew_text: וְלֹא עוֹד אֶלָּא בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁהֵם עוֹסְקִין בְּאַרְבַּע מִיתוֹת בֵּית דִּין פּוֹסְקִין מִמִּשְׁנָתָן וְאוֹמְרִים לִי 'דָּוִד הַבָּא עַל אֵשֶׁת אִישׁ מִיתָתוֹ בַּמֶּה' אָמַרְתִּי לָהֶם 'הַבָּא עַל אֵשֶׁת אִישׁ מִיתָתוֹ בְּחֶנֶק וְיֵשׁ לוֹ חֵלֶק לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא אֲבָל הַמַּלְבִּין פְּנֵי חֲבֵירוֹ בָּרַבִּים אֵין לוֹ חֵלֶק לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא'
human_translation: Moreover, at the time when they are engaged in four court-imposed death penalties they interrupt their study and say to me: David, one who engages in intercourse with a married woman, his death with what I said to them: one who engages in intercourse with a married woman his death is by strangulation, and he has a share in the World-to-Come. But one who humiliates another before the multitudes has no share in the World-to-Come.
llm_translation: And not only that, but at the time when they are engaged in the four death penalties, the court decides from their Mishnah and says to me, "David who comes upon a married woman, his death is by strangulation, and he has a share in the world to come. But one who embarrasses his fellow in public has no share in the world to come."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב אֲפִילּוּ בִּשְׁעַת חׇלְיוֹ שֶׁל דָּוִד קִיֵּים שְׁמֹנֶה עֶשְׂרֵה עוֹנוֹת שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר יָגַעְתִּי בְּאַנְחָתִי אַשְׂחֶה בְכׇל לַיְלָה מִטָּתִי בְּדִמְעָתִי עַרְשִׂי אַמְסֶה וְאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב בִּקֵּשׁ דָּוִד לַעֲבוֹד עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וַיְהִי דָּוִד בָּא עַד הָרֹאשׁ אֲשֶׁר יִשְׁתַּחֲוֶה שָׁם לֵאלֹהִים וְאֵין רֹאשׁ אֶלָּא עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וְהוּא צַלְמָא רֵישֵׁיהּ דִּי דְהַב טָב
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Rav says: Even during the time of his illness he fulfilled conjugal rights for eighteen as it is stated: “I am weary with my groaning; every night I speak in my bed; I melt away my couch with tears” And Rav Yehuda says Rav says: David sought to engage in idol worship as it is stated: “And it came to pass when David was at the top [ rosh ] of the ascent, where he would bow to God” and rosh nothing other than idol worship, as it is stated: “As for that image, its head [ reishei ] was of fine gold”
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: Even at the time of King David's illness, he fulfilled eighteen fasts, as it is stated, "I am weary with my groaning; every night I flood my bed, I drench my couch with my tears." And Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: David sought to engage in foreign worship, as it is stated, "And David went to the top where he would prostrate himself before God." And "top" refers only to foreign worship, as it is stated, "And its head was of fine gold."

hebrew_text: וְהִנֵּה לִקְרָאתוֹ חוּשַׁי הָאַרְכִּי קָרוּעַ כֻּתׇּנְתּוֹ וַאֲדָמָה עַל רֹאשׁוֹ אָמַר לוֹ לְדָוִד יֹאמְרוּ מֶלֶךְ שֶׁכְּמוֹתְךָ יַעֲבוֹד עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה אָמַר לוֹ מֶלֶךְ שֶׁכְּמוֹתִי יַהַרְגֶנּוּ בְּנוֹ מוּטָב יַעֲבוֹד עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה וְאַל יִתְחַלֵּל שֵׁם שָׁמַיִם בְּפַרְהֶסְיָא
human_translation: “Behold Hushai the Archite came to meet him with his coat rent and earth upon his head” said to David: Shall they say a king like you will engage in idol worship? said to him: a king like me, his son will kill him? It is preferable that he shall engage in idol worship and the name of Heaven shall not be desecrated in public
llm_translation: And behold, towards him Hushai the Archite came, his tunic torn and earth upon his head. He said to David, "The king should say, 'Just as I am, so is my servant. Let him serve a foreign service.'" The king said to him, "Just as my likeness, let his son kill him. It is better that he serves a foreign service and not desecrate the name of Heaven in public."

hebrew_text: אָמַר מַאי טַעְמָא קָנְסִיבַתְּ יְפַת תּוֹאַר אֲמַר לֵיהּ יְפַת תּוֹאַר רַחֲמָנָא שַׁרְיַיהּ אֲמַר לֵיהּ לָא דָּרְשַׁתְּ סְמוּכִין דִּסְמִיךְ לֵיהּ 'כִּי יִהְיֶה לְאִישׁ בֵּן סוֹרֵר וּמוֹרֶה' כׇּל הַנּוֹשֵׂא יְפַת תּוֹאַר יֵשׁ לוֹ בֵּן סוֹרֵר וּמוֹרֶה
human_translation: said What is the reason you married a beautiful woman, said to him: a beautiful woman, the Merciful One permitted her. said to him: you did not interpret the juxtaposed as juxtaposed to “If a man has a stubborn and rebellious son” Anyone who marries a beautiful woman has a stubborn and rebellious son.
llm_translation: He said, "What is the reason for the beauty of appearance?" He said to him, "Beauty of appearance, the Merciful One permitted it." He said to him, "You did not expound the adjacent verses that are adjacent to it, 'If a man has a wayward and rebellious son.' Anyone who marries a woman for her beauty of appearance, will have a wayward and rebellious son."

hebrew_text: דָּרֵשׁ רַבִּי דּוֹסְתַּאי דְּמִן בֵּירֵי לְמָה דָּוִד דּוֹמֶה  לְסוֹחֵר כּוּתִי אָמַר דָּוִד לִפְנֵי הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם שְׁגִיאוֹת מִי יָבִין [אֲמַר לֵיהּ] שְׁבִיקִי לָךְ וּמִנִּסְתָּרוֹת נַקֵּנִי שְׁבִיקִי לָךְ גַּם מִזֵּדִים חֲשֹׂךְ עַבְדֶּךָ שְׁבִיקִי לָךְ אַל יִמְשְׁלוּ בִי אָז אֵיתָם דְּלָא לִישְׁתַּעוֹ בִּי רַבָּנַן שְׁבִיקִי לָךְ
human_translation: Rabbi Dostai from Biri taught: To what is David comparable? to a Samaritan merchant, David said before the Holy One, Blessed be He: Master of the Universe: “Who can discern his errors” said to him: They are forgiven for you. “Cleanse me from hidden faults” They are forgiven for you. “Keep back your servant also from intentional sins” They are forgiven for you. “Let them not have dominion over me, then I shall be faultless” that the Sages will not speak of me They are forgiven for you.
llm_translation: Rabbi Dostai from Beirei expounded: What is David comparable to? To a Kutite merchant. David said before the Holy One, blessed be He: "My Master of the world, who can discern errors? He said to him: 'Forgive me, and from hidden faults cleanse me.' Forgive me also from presumptuous sins. Keep back Your servant from them; let them not rule over me. Then I shall be blameless, and innocent of great transgression."

hebrew_text: וְנִקֵּיתִי מִפֶּשַׁע רָב שֶׁלֹּא יִכָּתֵב סִרְחוֹנִי אָמַר לוֹ אִי אֶפְשָׁר וּמָה יוֹד שֶׁנָּטַלְתִּי מִשָּׂרַי עוֹמֵד וְצוֹוֵחַ כַּמָּה שָׁנִים עַד שֶׁבָּא יְהוֹשֻׁעַ וְהוֹסַפְתִּי לוֹ שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר 'וַיִּקְרָא מֹשֶׁה לְהוֹשֵׁעַ בִּן נוּן יְהוֹשֻׁעַ' כׇּל הַפָּרָשָׁה כּוּלָּהּ עַל אַחַת כַּמָּה וְכַמָּה
human_translation: “And I shall be clear from great transgression” that my transgression will not be written said to him: impossible. And just as yod that I removed from Sarai, standing and screaming several years until Joshua came and I added to his as it is stated: “And Moses called Hosea, son of Nun, Joshua [ Yehoshua ]” the entire portion all the more so
llm_translation: "And I will be cleared of great sin, that my transgression may not be written. Serachoni said to him: It is impossible. And what merit do I have that I have taken from my ministers? He stood and shouted for many years until Joshua came. And I will add to him, as it is said, 'And Moses called Joshua the son of Nun, Joshua.' The entire portion, all of it, how much and how much."

hebrew_text: וְנִקֵּיתִי מִפֶּשַׁע רָב אָמַר לְפָנָיו רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם מְחוֹל לִי עַל אוֹתוֹ עָוֹן כּוּלּוֹ אָמַר כְּבָר עָתִיד שְׁלֹמֹה בִּנְךָ לוֹמַר בְּחׇכְמָתוֹ 'הֲיַחְתֶּה אִישׁ אֵשׁ בְּחֵיקוֹ וּבְגָדָיו לֹא תִשָּׂרַפְנָה אִם יְהַלֵּךְ אִישׁ עַל הַגֶּחָלִים וְרַגְלָיו לֹא תִכָּוֶינָה כֵּן הַבָּא עַל אֵשֶׁת רֵעֵהוּ לֹא יִנָּקֶה כׇּל הַנֹּגֵעַ בָּהּ' אָמַר לֵיהּ כֹּל הָכִי נִטְרַד הָהוּא גַּבְרָא אָמַר לוֹ קִבֵּל עָלֶיךָ יִסּוּרִין קִבֵּל עָלָיו
human_translation: “And I shall be clear from great transgression” said before Master of the Universe, pardon me for that entire sin. said Your son Solomon is already destined to say with his wisdom: “Can a man take fire in his lap and his garments not be burned? Can one walk on hot coals and his feet not be scorched? So too one who lies with his neighbor’s wife; anyone who touches her shall not go unpunished” said to Him: Will that man, be expelled that entire said to Accept upon yourself afflictions, He accepted upon himself.
llm_translation: "And I will be cleared from great transgression," he said before Him, the Master of the Universe forgives me for that entire sin. He said, "Already Solomon your son is destined to say in his wisdom, 'Can a man carry fire in his bosom and his clothes not be burned? If a man walks on coals, will his feet not be scorched?' So is one who goes to his neighbor's wife; he will not be acquitted. He said to him, 'Accept upon yourself afflictions.' He accepted upon himself."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב שִׁשָּׁה חֳדָשִׁים נִצְטָרַע דָּוִד וְנִסְתַּלְּקָה הֵימֶנּוּ שְׁכִינָה וּפֵירְשׁוּ מִמֶּנּוּ סַנְהֶדְרִין נִצְטָרַע דִּכְתִיב תְּחַטְּאֵנִי בְאֵזוֹב וְאֶטְהָר תְּכַבְּסֵנִי וּמִשֶּׁלֶג אַלְבִּין נִסְתַּלְּקָה הֵימֶנּוּ שְׁכִינָה דִּכְתִיב הָשִׁיבָה לִּי שְׂשׂוֹן יִשְׁעֶךָ וְרוּחַ נְדִיבָה תִסְמְכֵנִי וּפֵרְשׁוּ מִמֶּנּוּ סַנְהֶדְרִין דִּכְתִיב יָשׁוּבוּ לִי יְרֵאֶיךָ וְגוֹ' שִׁשָּׁה חֳדָשִׁים מְנָלַן דִּכְתִיב וְהַיָּמִים אֲשֶׁר מָלַךְ דָּוִד עַל יִשְׂרָאֵל אַרְבָּעִים שָׁנָה
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Rav says: six months David was afflicted with leprosy and the Divine Presence abandoned him and the Sanhedrin dissociated from him. He was afflicted with leprosy, as it is stated: “Purge me with hyssop and I shall be clean; wash me, and I shall be whiter than snow” The Divine Presence abandoned him, as it is stated: “Restore me to joy of Your salvation; and uphold me with a willing spirit” And the Sanhedrin dissociated from him, as it is stated: “Let those who fear You turn to me, From where do we six months? as it is written: “And the days that David reigned over Israel were forty years;
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: "King David was afflicted with tzara'at for six months, and the Divine Presence departed from him. The Sanhedrin separated from him. How do we know that David was afflicted with tzara'at? As it is written, 'Purge me with hyssop, and I shall be clean; wash me, and I shall be whiter than snow.' The Divine Presence departed from him. As it is written, 'Restore to me the joy of Your salvation, and a willing spirit sustain me.' The Sanhedrin separated from him. As it is written, 'Let Your followers return to me.' Where do we derive that David's affliction lasted for six months? As it is written, 'The days that David reigned over Israel were forty years.'"

hebrew_text: בְּחֶבְרוֹן מָלַךְ שֶׁבַע שָׁנִים וּבִירוּשָׁלִַים מָלַךְ שְׁלֹשִׁים וְשָׁלֹשׁ שָׁנִים וּכְתִיב בְּחֶבְרוֹן מָלַךְ עַל יְהוּדָה שֶׁבַע שָׁנִים וְשִׁשָּׁה חֳדָשִׁים וְגוֹ' וְהָנֵי שִׁשָּׁה חֳדָשִׁים לָא קָחָשֵׁיב שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ נִצְטָרַע
human_translation: in Hebron he reigned seven years, and in Jerusalem he reigned thirty-three years” And it is written: “In Hebron he reigned over Judah seven years and six months And those six months, did not tally Conclude from it was afflicted with leprosy.
llm_translation: In Hebron he reigned seven years, and in Jerusalem he reigned thirty-three years. And it is written: "In Hebron he reigned over Judah seven years and six months." And those six months are not considered. Learn from it that he became afflicted with tzara'at.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לְפָנָיו רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם מְחוֹל לִי עַל אוֹתוֹ עָוֹן מָחוּל לָךְ עֲשֵׂה עִמִּי אוֹת לְטוֹבָה וְיִרְאוּ שֹׂנְאַי וְיֵבֹשׁוּ כִּי אַתָּה ה' עֲזַרְתַּנִי וְנִחַמְתָּנִי אֲמַר לֵיהּ בְּחַיֶּיךָ אֵינִי מוֹדִיעַ אֲבָל אֲנִי מוֹדִיעַ בְּחַיֵּי שְׁלֹמֹה בִּנְךָ
human_translation: said before Him Master of the Universe, pardon me for this sin. It is forgiven for you. “Perform on my behalf a sign for good, that they that hate me may see it and be put to shame” said to him: In your lifetime I will not make known but I will make known in the lifetime of your son, Solomon.
llm_translation: He said before Him, Master of the Universe, forgive me for that sin, forgive for You, do good with me, and let my enemies see and be ashamed, for You, Hashem, have helped me and comforted me. He said to him, "By your life, I do not inform, but I inform by the life of your son Solomon."

hebrew_text: בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁבָּנָה שְׁלֹמֹה אֶת בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ בִּיקֵּשׁ לְהַכְנִיס אָרוֹן לְבֵית קׇדְשֵׁי הַקֳּדָשִׁים דָּבְקוּ שְׁעָרִים זֶה בָּזֶה אָמַר עֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבָּעָה רְנָנוֹת וְלֹא נַעֲנָה אָמַר 'שְׂאוּ שְׁעָרִים רָאשֵׁיכֶם וְהִנָּשְׂאוּ פִּתְחֵי עוֹלָם וְיָבוֹא מֶלֶךְ הַכָּבוֹד מִי זֶה מֶלֶךְ הַכָּבוֹד ה' עִזּוּז וְגִבּוֹר ה' גִּבּוֹר מִלְחָמָה' וְנֶאֱמַר 'שְׂאוּ שְׁעָרִים רָאשֵׁיכֶם וּשְׂאוּ פִּתְחֵי עוֹלָם וְיָבוֹא מֶלֶךְ הַכָּבוֹד' וְגוֹ' וְלֹא נַעֲנָה
human_translation: When Solomon built the Temple sought to bring the Ark into the Holy of Holies, gates clung together uttered twenty-four songs and was not answered. He said: “Lift up your heads, you gates, and be you lifted up, you everlasting doors, that the King of glory may come in. Who is the King of glory? The Lord strong and mighty, the Lord mighty in battle” And it is stated: “Lift up your heads, you gates, yea, lift them up, you everlasting doors, that the King of glory may come in. and he was not answered.
llm_translation: At the time when Solomon built the Temple, he sought to bring the Ark into the Holy of Holies. The doors clung to each other. He said, "Twenty-four songs were sung, and the doors did not open." He said, "Lift up your heads, O gates, and be lifted up, O ancient doors, that the King of Glory may come in." Who is this King of Glory? The Lord strong and mighty, the Lord mighty in battle. And it is said, "Lift up your heads, O gates, and lift them up, O ancient doors, that the King of Glory may come in," etc. But the doors did not open.

hebrew_text: כֵּיוָן שֶׁאָמַר ה' אֱלֹהִים אַל תָּשֵׁב פְּנֵי מְשִׁיחֶךָ זָכְרָה לְחַסְדֵי דָּוִיד עַבְדֶּךָ מִיָּד נַעֲנָה בְּאוֹתָהּ שָׁעָה נֶהְפְּכוּ פְּנֵי שׂוֹנְאֵי דָּוִד כְּשׁוּלֵי קְדֵירָה וְיָדְעוּ כׇּל יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁמָּחַל לוֹ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא עַל אוֹתוֹ הֶעָוֹן
human_translation: Once he said: “O Lord God, turn not away the face of Your anointed; remember the good deeds of David Your servant” he was immediately answered, At that moment, the faces of all of David’s enemies turned like the bottom of a pot. And all of the Jewish people knew that the Holy One, Blessed be He, had forgiven him for that sin,
llm_translation: Since the Lord God said, "Do not turn away the face of your anointed one, remember the acts of kindness of your servant David," immediately at that moment the faces of David's enemies turned pale like the bottom of a pot, and all of Israel knew that the Holy One, blessed be He, had forgiven him for that sin.

hebrew_text: גֵּחֲזִי  דִּכְתִיב וַיֵּלֶךְ אֱלִישָׁע דַּמֶּשֶׂק לְהֵיכָא אֲזַל אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן שֶׁהָלַךְ לְהַחֲזִיר גֵּחֲזִי בִּתְשׁוּבָה וְלֹא חָזַר אָמַר לוֹ חֲזוֹר בָּךְ אָמַר לוֹ כָּךְ מְקוּבְּלַנִי מִמְּךָ הַחוֹטֵא וּמַחְטִיא אֶת הָרַבִּים אֵין מַסְפִּיקִין בְּיָדוֹ לַעֲשׂוֹת תְּשׁוּבָה
human_translation: Gehazi, as it is written: And Elisha went to Damascus Where did he go, Rabbi Yoḥanan says: He went to cause Gehazi to repent, but he did not repent. said to him: Repent. said to him: This I received from you: Whoever sins and causes the masses to sin is not given the opportunity to repent.
llm_translation: Geḥazi, as it is written, "And Elisha went from Damascus" - where did he go? Rabbi Yoḥanan said: He went to bring back Geḥazi in repentance, but he did not return. He said to him: Return! He said to him: It has been accepted from you, the sinner and the one who causes others to sin, that you do not have the ability to repent.

hebrew_text: מַאי עֲבַד אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי אֶבֶן שׁוֹאֶבֶת תָּלָה לְחַטַּאת יָרׇבְעָם וְהֶעֱמִידָהּ בֵּין שָׁמַיִם לָאָרֶץ וְאִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי שֵׁם חָקַק בְּפִיהָ וְהָיְתָה מַכְרֶזֶת וְאוֹמֶרֶת אָנֹכִי וְלֹא יִהְיֶה לְךָ
human_translation: What did he do There are who say he hung a magnetic rock on Jeroboam’s sin, he suspended it between heaven and earth, And there are who say: He engraved name on its mouth, and it would declare and say: “I am and: “You shall not have
llm_translation: What does it do? There are those who say: The stone that absorbed the sins of Jeroboam's sin-offering hung suspended between heaven and earth. And there are those who say: It engraved its name on its mouth and proclaimed, saying, "I am, and there is none besides me."

hebrew_text: וְאִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי רַבָּנַן דְּחָה מִקַּמֵּיהּ שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וַיֹּאמְרוּ בְנֵי הַנְּבִיאִים אֶל אֱלִישָׁע הִנֵּה [נָא] הַמָּקוֹם אֲשֶׁר אֲנַחְנוּ יֹשְׁבִים שָׁם לְפָנֶיךָ צַר מִמֶּנּוּ מִכְּלָל דְּעַד הַשְׁתָּא לָא הֲווֹ פָּיְישִׁי
human_translation: And there are who say: pushed the Sages from before him, as it is stated: “And the sons of the prophets said to Elisha, behold this place where we are staying before you is too cramped for us” by inference that until now they were not numerous cramped
llm_translation: And there are those who say, the Rabbis said, he pushed away from him, as it is said, "And the sons of the prophets said to Elisha, 'See now, the place where we dwell before you is too cramped for us.'" This implies that until now they were not impudent.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן לְעוֹלָם תְּהֵא שְׂמֹאל דּוֹחָה וְיָמִין מְקָרֶבֶת לֹא כֶּאֱלִישָׁע שֶׁדְּחָפוֹ לְגֵחֲזִי בִּשְׁתֵּי יָדַיִם וְלֹא כִּיהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן פְּרַחְיָה שֶׁדְּחָפוֹ לְיֵשׁוּ הַנּוֹצְרִי בִּשְׁתֵּי
human_translation: The Sages taught: Always have the left drive away and the right draw near, unlike Elisha, who pushed away Gehazi with his two hands and unlike Yehoshua ben Peraḥya, who pushed away Jesus the Nazarene with his two hands.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: Always let the left push away and the right draw near, not like Elisha, who pushed away Gehazi with both hands, and not like Joshua ben Perachiah, who pushed away Jesus the Nazarene with both.

hebrew_text: גֵּחֲזִי דִּכְתִיב 'וַיֹּאמֶר נַעֲמָן הוֹאֵל וְקַח כִּכָּרָיִם וַיִּפְרׇץ בּוֹ וַיָּצַר כִּכְּרַיִם כֶּסֶף' וְגוֹ 'וַיֹּאמֶר אֵלָיו אֱלִישָׁע מֵאַיִן גֵּחֲזִי וַיֹּאמֶר לֹא הָלַךְ עַבְדְּךָ אָנֶה וָאָנָה וַיֹּאמֶר אֵלָיו לֹא לִבִּי הָלַךְ כַּאֲשֶׁר הָפַךְ אִישׁ מֵעַל מֶרְכַּבְתּוֹ לִקְרָאתֶךָ הַעֵת לָקַחַת אֶת הַכֶּסֶף וְלָקַחַת בְּגָדִים וְזֵיתִים וּכְרָמִים וְצֹאן וּבָקָר וַעֲבָדִים וְשֶׁפַּחוֹת' וּמִי שְׁקַל כּוּלֵּי הַאי כֶּסֶף וּבְגָדִים הוּא דִּשְׁקַל
human_translation: Gehazi as it is written: “And Naaman said: Be content, take two talents. And he urged him, and bound two talents of silver “And Elisha said to him: Where from, Gehazi? And he said: Your servant went nowhere at all. And he said to him: Went not my heart with you, when the man turned back from his chariot to meet you? Is it the time to receive silver and to receive garments, and olive groves, and vineyards, and sheep and cattle, and menservants and maidservants?” And did take all that? It is silver and garments that he took.
llm_translation: Geḥazi as it is written, "And Naaman said, 'Please, take two talents.' And he urged him and bound two talents of silver" etc. "And Elisha said to him, 'From where, Geḥazi?' And he said, 'Your servant did not go here or there.' And he said to him, 'Did not my heart go when the man turned from his chariot to meet you? Is it time to take silver and to take garments, olive yards, vineyards, sheep, oxen, male servants, and female servants?' And who took all this silver and garments? It was he who took."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק בְּאוֹתָהּ שָׁעָה הָיָה אֱלִישָׁע יוֹשֵׁב וְדוֹרֵשׁ בִּשְׁמוֹנָה שְׁרָצִים נַעֲמָן שַׂר צְבָא מֶלֶךְ אֲרָם הָיָה מְצוֹרָע אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ הָהִיא רָבִיתָא דְּאִישְׁתְּבַאי מֵאַרְעָא יִשְׂרָאֵל אִי אָזְלַתְּ לְגַבַּי אֱלִישָׁע מַסֵּי לָךְ כִּי אֲתָא אֲמַר לֵיהּ זִיל טְבוֹל בְּיַרְדֵּן אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַחוֹכֵי קָא מְחַיְּיכַתְּ בִּי אָמְרִי לֵיהּ הָנְהוּ דַּהֲווֹ בַּהֲדֵיהּ מַאי נָפְקָא לָךְ מִינַּהּ זִיל נַסִּי אֲזַל וּטְבַל בְּיַרְדְּנָא וְאִיתַּסִּי אֲתָא אַיְיתִי לֵיהּ כֹּל הָנֵי דְּנָקֵיט לָא צְבָא לְקַבּוֹלֵי מִינֵּיהּ גֵּחֲזִי אִיפְּטַר מִקַּמֵּיהּ אֱלִישָׁע אֲזַל שְׁקַל מַאי דִּשְׁקַל וְאַפְקֵיד
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzḥak says: At that moment, Elisha was sitting and teaching eight creeping animals. Naaman, the general of the army of Aram, was a leper. A certain young Jewish woman who had been taken captive from Eretz Yisrael said to him: If you go to Elisha, he will heal you. When came said to him: Go immerse in the Jordan. said to him: Are you mocking me Those who were with said to him: What is the difference to you? Go, try went and immersed in the Jordan and was healed. came brought to all those that he had did not agree to receive from him. Gehazi took leave from before Elisha went took what he took, and deposited
llm_translation: Rabbi Yitzchak said: At that time, Elisha was sitting and expounding on the eight types of leprosy. Naaman, the commander of the army of the king of Aram, was a leper. The wife of that Aramean officer said to him, "If you go to the prophet Elisha from the land of Israel, he will cure you." So Naaman went to him. When he came, Elisha said to him, "Go and immerse yourself in the Jordan seven times." Naaman was angry and said, "I thought he would surely come out to me and stand and call on the name of the Lord his God, wave his hand over the spot and cure me of my leprosy. Are not Abana and Pharpar, the rivers of Damascus, better than all the waters of Israel? Couldn't I wash in them and be cleansed?" So he turned and went off in a rage. But his servants approached him and said, "My father, if the prophet had told you to do some great thing, would you not have done it? How much more, then, when he tells you, 'Wash and be cleansed'!" So he went down and dipped himself in the Jordan seven times, as the man of God had told him, and his flesh was restored and became clean like that of a young boy.

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא חַזְיַיהּ אֱלִישָׁע לְצָרַעַת דַּהֲוָה פָּרְחָה עִלָּוֵיה רֵישֵׁיהּ אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָשָׁע הִגִּיעַ עֵת לִיטּוֹל שְׂכַר שְׁמֹנָה שְׁרָצִים וְצָרַעַת נַעֲמָן תִּדְבַּק בְּךָ וּבְזַרְעֲךָ לְעוֹלָם וַיֵּצֵא מִלְּפָנָיו מְצֹרָע כַּשָּׁלֶג וְאַרְבָּעָה אֲנָשִׁים הָיוּ מְצֹרָעִים פֶּתַח הַשָּׁעַר אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן גֵּחֲזִי וּשְׁלֹשֶׁת בָּנָיו
human_translation: When came, Elisha saw the leprosy that had grown on head. said to him: Wicked one! The time has arrived to take reward for the eight creeping animals. “The leprosy of Naaman shall cleave to you and to your seed forever. And he went out of his presence a leper as white as snow” “And there were four men afflicted with leprosy at the entrance of the gate” Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Gehazi and his three sons,
llm_translation: When Hazya, the servant of Elisha, came to Naaman, who had leprosy, and the leprosy had spread on his body, he said to him, "The wicked one has reached the time to receive the reward of eight rodents, and the leprosy of Naaman shall cling to you and your descendants forever." And he went out from before him a leper as white as snow, and there were four men who were lepers at the entrance of the gate. Rabbi Yochanan said: Gehazi and his three sons.

hebrew_text: יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן פְּרַחְיָה מַאי הִיא כִּדְקַטְלִינְהוּ יַנַּאי מַלְכָּא לְרַבָּנַן אֲזַל יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן פְּרַחְיָה וְיֵשׁוּ לַאֲלֶכְּסַנְדְּרִיָּא שֶׁל מִצְרַיִם כִּי הֲוָה שְׁלָמָא שְׁלַח לֵיהּ שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן שָׁטַח מִינִּי יְרוּשָׁלַיִם עִיר הַקֹּדֶשׁ לִיכִי אָלֶכְּסַנְדְּרִיָּה שֶׁל מִצְרַיִם אֲחוֹתִי בַּעֲלִי שָׁרוּי בְּתוֹכֵךְ וְאָנֹכִי יוֹשֶׁבֶת שׁוֹמֵמָה
human_translation: What is Yehoshua ben Peraḥya? When King Yannai was killing the Sages, Yehoshua ben Peraḥya and Jesus, went to Alexandria of Egypt. When there was peace Shimon ben Shataḥ sent to From me, Jerusalem, the holy city, to you, Alexandria of Egypt: My sister, my husband is located among you and I sit desolate.
llm_translation: Yehoshua ben Parchiah, what is it? As Yanai killed them, the king said to the sages. Yehoshua ben Parchiah went and there was an Alexandrian woman from Egypt, for there was peace, Shimon ben Shatach sent him from Jerusalem, the holy city, "Go to Alexandria of Egypt, my sister, my husband is imprisoned among you, and I am sitting desolate."

hebrew_text: קָם אֲתָא וְאִתְרְמִי לֵיהּ הָהוּא אוּשְׁפִּיזָא עֲבַדוּ לֵיהּ יְקָרָא טוּבָא אֲמַר כַּמָּה יָפָה אַכְסַנְיָא זוֹ אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי עֵינֶיהָ טְרוּטוֹת אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָשָׁע בְּכָךְ אַתָּה עוֹסֵק אַפֵּיק אַרְבַּע מְאָה שִׁיפּוּרֵי וְשַׂמְתִּיהָ
human_translation: arose, came, and happened a certain inn They treated him with great honor. said: How beautiful is this inn. said to him: my teacher, the eyes of are narrow [ terutot ]. said to him: Wicked one! you involve yourself with regard to that He produced four hundred shofarot and ostracized him.
llm_translation: He came and found that certain Oshpiza had made for him a precious dish. He said, "How beautiful is this innkeeper!" Rabbi said to him, "Her eyes are round." He said to him, "Wicked one, is this what you are occupied with?" He took out four hundred mirrors and showed them to him.

hebrew_text: אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ כַּמָּה זִימְנִין אֲמַר לֵיהּ קַבְּלָן לָא הָוֵי קָא מַשְׁגַּח בֵּיהּ יוֹמָא חַד הֲוָה קָא קָרֵי קְרִיאַת שְׁמַע אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ סָבַר לְקַבּוֹלֵי אַחְוִי לֵיהּ בִּידֵיהּ הוּא סָבַר מִידְחָא דָּחֵי לִי אֲזַל זְקַף לְבֵינְתָּא וְהִשְׁתַּחֲוָה לָהּ אֲמַר לֵיהּ הֲדַר בָּךְ אֲמַר לֵיהּ כָּךְ מְקוּבְּלַנִי מִמְּךָ כָּל הַחוֹטֵא וּמַחְטִיא אֶת הָרַבִּים אֵין מַסְפִּיקִין בְּיָדוֹ לַעֲשׂוֹת תְּשׁוּבָה וְאָמַר מָר יֵשׁוּ כִּישֵּׁף וְהֵסִית וְהִדִּיחַ אֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל
human_translation: came before several times said to him: Accept our, took no notice of him. One day was reciting Shema came before him intended to accept his signaled him with his hand thought: He is driving me away. He went stood a brick and he bowed to it. said to Repent. said to him: This I received from you: Whoever sins and causes the masses to sin is not given the opportunity to repent. And the Master says: Jesus performed sorcery, incited and led Israel astray.
llm_translation: He came before him. How many times? He said to him, "Accept us." He was not paying attention to him. One day he was reading the Shema. He came before him. He thought to accept him. He wanted to take him by the hand. He thought, "Since he pushes me away, I will go and bow before her." He said to him, "Return to yourself." He said to him, "This is how I have learned from you: Anyone who sins and causes others to sin, he does not have the ability to repent. And Mar said, 'Yeshu practiced sorcery, led astray, and deceived Israel.'"

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר יֵצֶר תִּינוֹק וְאִשָּׁה  תְּהֵא שְׂמֹאל דּוֹחָה וְיָמִין מְקָרֶבֶת
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: inclination, a child, and a woman, have the left drive away and the right draw near.
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar said, the inclination of a child and a woman should be suppressed, while the left hand pushes away and the right hand brings close.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן שְׁלֹשָׁה חֳלָאִים חָלָה אֱלִישָׁע אֶחָד שֶׁגֵּירָה דּוּבִּים בַּתִּינוֹקוֹת וְאֶחָד שֶׁדְּחָפוֹ לְגֵחֲזִי בִּשְׁתֵּי יָדַיִם וְאֶחָד שֶׁמֵּת בּוֹ [שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וֶאֱלִישָׁע חָלָה אֶת חׇלְיוֹ'
human_translation: The Sages taught: Elisha fell ill with three illnesses: One that he incited bears to children and one that he pushed Gehazi away with two hands and one from which he died, as it is stated: “And Elisha was fallen ill of his illness
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: Three illnesses afflicted Elisha - one that he swallowed the cubs of bears, one that he was seized by leprosy in both hands, and one that he died from. As it is stated: "And Elisha fell sick with his illness."

hebrew_text: עַד אַבְרָהָם לֹא הָיָה זִקְנָה כֹּל דְּחָזֵי לְאַבְרָהָם אֲמַר הַאי יִצְחָק כֹּל דְּחָזֵי לְיִצְחָק אָמַר הַאי אַבְרָהָם בְּעָא אַבְרָהָם רַחֲמֵי דְּלֶיהְוֵי לֵיהּ זִקְנָה שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וְאַבְרָהָם זָקֵן בָּא בַּיָּמִים עַד יַעֲקֹב לָא הֲוָה חוּלְשָׁא בְּעָא רַחֲמֵי וַהֲוָה חוּלְשָׁא שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וַיֹּאמֶר לְיוֹסֵף הִנֵּה אָבִיךָ חֹלֶה עַד אֱלִישָׁע לָא הֲוָה אִינִישׁ חָלֵישׁ דְּמִיתְּפַח וַאֲתָא אֱלִישָׁע וּבְעָא רַחֲמֵי וְאִיתְּפַח שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וֶאֱלִישָׁע חָלָה אֶת חׇלְיוֹ אֲשֶׁר יָמוּת בּוֹ
human_translation: Until Abraham there was no aging, Anyone who saw Abraham said: That is Isaac, anyone who saw Isaac said: That is Abraham. Abraham prayed for mercy, that he would undergo aging, as it is stated: “And Abraham was old, well stricken in age” Until Jacob there was no weakness, prayed for mercy and there was weakness, as it is stated: “And one said to Joseph: Behold, your father is ill” Until Elisha, there was no ill person who recovered, and Elisha came and prayed for mercy and recovered, as it is stated: “And Elisha was fallen ill of his illness from which he was to die”
llm_translation: Until Abraham, there was no old age. All who saw Abraham said, "This is Isaac." All who saw Isaac said, "This is Abraham." Abraham sought mercy for himself that he should not become old, as it is stated, "And Abraham was old, advanced in days." Until Jacob, there was no illness. Jacob sought mercy and there was illness, as it is stated, "And he said to Joseph, 'Behold, your father is ill.'" Until Elisha, no one was ill. Elisha came and sought mercy, and he became ill, as it is stated, "And Elisha became ill with the illness of which he would die."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי' דּוֹר הַמַּבּוּל אֵין לָהֶם חֵלֶק לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא וְאֵין עוֹמְדִין בַּדִּין שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר לֹא יָדוֹן רוּחִי בָאָדָם לְעֹלָם לֹא דִּין וְלֹא רוּחַ דּוֹר הַפְּלַגָּה אֵין לָהֶם חֵלֶק לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וַיָּפֶץ ה' אֹתָם מִשָּׁם עַל פְּנֵי כׇל הָאָרֶץ וּכְתִיב וּמִשָּׁם הֱפִיצָם וַיָּפֶץ ה' אֹתָם בָּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה וּמִשָּׁם הֱפִיצָם ה' לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא אַנְשֵׁי סְדוֹם אֵין לָהֶם חֵלֶק לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וְאַנְשֵׁי סְדֹם רָעִים וְחַטָּאִים לַה' מְאֹד רָעִים בָּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה וְחַטָּאִים לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא אֲבָל עוֹמְדִין בַּדִּין
human_translation: the generation of the flood have no share in the World-to-Come and will not stand in judgment as it is stated: “My soul shall not abide [ yadon ] in man forever” neither judgment [ din ] nor souls the generation of the dispersion have no share in the World-to-Come, as it is stated: “And the Lord scattered them from there upon the face of all the earth” and it is written: “And from there did the Lord scatter them “And the Lord scattered them” in this world; “and from there did the Lord scatter them” for the World-to-Come. The people of Sodom have no share in the World-to-Come, as it is stated: “And the men of Sodom were wicked and sinners before the Lord exceedingly” “Wicked” in this world; “and sinners” for the World-to-Come. But they will stand in judgment
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: The generation of the Flood have no portion in the World to Come, and they do not stand in judgment, as it is stated: "My spirit shall not contend forever concerning man" (Genesis 6:3) — neither through judgment nor through the spirit. The generation of the Dispersion have no portion in the World to Come, as it is stated: "And the Lord scattered them abroad from there upon the face of all the earth" (Genesis 11:8). And it is written: "And from there the Lord scattered them abroad upon the face of all the earth" (Genesis 11:9). The Lord scattered them in this world, and from there the Lord will scatter them in the World to Come. The people of Sodom have no portion in the World to Come, as it is stated: "And the people of Sodom were wicked and great sinners against the Lord exceedingly" (Genesis 13:13) — wicked in this world and sinners in the World to Come. However, they do stand in judgment.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה אוֹמֵר אֵלּוּ וָאֵלּוּ אֵין עוֹמְדִין בַּדִּין שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר עַל כֵּן לֹא יָקֻמוּ
human_translation: Rabbi Neḥemya says: these, and those, will not stand in judgment, as it is stated: “Therefore the wicked shall not stand
llm_translation: Rabbi Nechemiah says: These and these do not stand in judgment, as it is said, "Therefore they shall not rise."

hebrew_text: רְשָׁעִים בַּמִּשְׁפָּט וְחַטָּאִים בַּעֲדַת צַדִּיקִים עַל כֵּן לֹא יָקוּמוּ רְשָׁעִים בַּמִּשְׁפָּט  זֶה דּוֹר הַמַּבּוּל וְחַטָּאִים בַּעֲדַת צַדִּיקִים  אֵלּוּ אַנְשֵׁי סְדוֹם אָמְרוּ לוֹ אֵינָם עוֹמְדִין בַּעֲדַת צַדִּיקִים אֲבָל עוֹמְדִין בַּעֲדַת רְשָׁעִים
human_translation: in judgment, nor sinners in the congregation of the righteous” “Therefore the wicked shall not stand in judgment”; this the generation of the flood, “Nor sinners in the congregation of the righteous”; these are the people of Sodom, said to They will not stand in the congregation of the righteous, but they will stand in the congregation of the wicked.
llm_translation: Wicked in judgment, and sinners in the council of the righteous, therefore the wicked shall not rise in judgment. This is the generation of the Flood. And sinners in the council of the righteous, these are the people of Sodom. They said to Him, "They do not stand in the council of the righteous, but they stand in the council of the wicked."

hebrew_text: מְרַגְּלִים אֵין לָהֶם חֵלֶק לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וַיָּמֻתוּ הָאֲנָשִׁים מוֹצִאֵי דִבַּת הָאָרֶץ רָעָה בַּמַּגֵּפָה לִפְנֵי ה' וַיָּמֻתוּ בָּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה בַּמַּגֵּפָה לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא
human_translation: The spies have no share in the World-to-Come, as it is stated: “And those men who spread the evil report about the land died by plague before the Lord” “And…died” in this world; “by plague” for the World-to-Come.
llm_translation: Spies, they have no portion in the World to Come, as it is stated, "And the men who brought forth an evil report about the land died by the plague before the Lord" (Numbers 14:37). They died in this world by the plague, and they will die in the World to Come by the plague.

hebrew_text: דּוֹר הַמִּדְבָּר אֵין לָהֶם חֵלֶק לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא וְאֵין עוֹמְדִין בַּדִּין שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר בַּמִּדְבָּר הַזֶּה יִתַּמּוּ וְשָׁם יָמֻתוּ  דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר עֲלֵיהֶם הוּא אוֹמֵר אִסְפוּ לִי חֲסִידָי כֹּרְתֵי בְרִיתִי עֲלֵי זָבַח
human_translation: the generation of the wilderness have no share in the World-to-Come and will not stand in judgment, as it is stated: “In this wilderness they shall be consumed, and there they shall die” the statement of Rabbi Akiva. Rabbi Eliezer says: about them says: “Gather My pious together to Me, those that have entered into My covenant by offering”
llm_translation: The generation of the desert, they have no portion in the World to Come, and they do not stand in judgment, as it is stated: "In this desert they shall be consumed, and there they shall die." These are the words of Rabbi Akiva. Rabbi Eliezer says about them: "He says, 'Gather to Me My pious ones, those who made a covenant with Me over a sacrifice.'"

hebrew_text: עֲדַת קֹרַח אֵינָהּ עֲתִידָה לַעֲלוֹת שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וַתְּכַס עֲלֵיהֶם הָאָרֶץ  בָּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה וַיֹּאבְדוּ מִתּוֹךְ הַקָּהָל  לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר עֲלֵיהֶם הוּא אוֹמֵר ה' מֵמִית וּמְחַיֶּה מוֹרִיד שְׁאוֹל וַיָּעַל
human_translation: The assembly of Korah is not destined to arise as it is stated: “And the earth closed upon them” in this world, “And they perished from among the assembly” in the World-to-Come; the statement of Rabbi Akiva. Rabbi Eliezer says: About them says: “The Lord kills and makes alive; He lowers to the grave, and raises”
llm_translation: The congregation of Korah is not destined to rise, as it is stated, "and the earth covered them" - in this world, and they perished from among the assembly. In the world to come, the words of Rabbi Akiva. Rabbi Eliezer says about them, "He says, 'The Lord kills and gives life, brings down to Sheol and raises up.'"

hebrew_text: גְּמָ' תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן דּוֹר הַמַּבּוּל אֵין לָהֶם חֵלֶק לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר 'וַיִּמַח אֶת כׇּל הַיְקוּם אֲשֶׁר עַל פְּנֵי הָאֲדָמָה' 'וַיִּמַח אֶת כׇּל הַיְּקוּם'  בָּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה 'וַיִּמָּחוּ מִן הָאָרֶץ'  לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בְּתֵירָא אוֹמֵר לֹא חַיִּין וְלֹא נִדּוֹנִין שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר 'לֹא יָדוֹן רוּחִי בָאָדָם לְעֹלָם'  לֹא דִּין וְלֹא רוּחַ דָּבָר אַחֵר 'לֹא יָדוֹן רוּחִי'  שֶׁלֹּא תְּהֵא נִשְׁמָתָן חוֹזֶרֶת לִנְדָנָהּ
human_translation: The Sages taught the generation of the flood have no share in the World-to-Come, as it is stated: “And He obliterated every living thing that was upon the face of the ground, “And He obliterated every living thing” in this world, “and they were obliterated from the earth” for the World-to-Come; the statement of Rabbi Akiva. Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira says: neither live nor be judged, as it is stated: “My soul shall not abide [ yadon ] in man forever” neither judgment [ din ], nor souls Alternatively, “My soul shall not abide” their souls will not return to their sheaths [ nadan ],
llm_translation: The Sages taught: The generation of the Flood have no portion in the World to Come, as it is stated, "And He blotted out every living substance which was upon the face of the ground" (Genesis 7:23). "And He blotted out every living substance" - in this world. "And they were blotted out from the earth" - in the World to Come. These are the words of Rabbi Akiva. Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira says: They are not judged and they are not condemned, as it is stated, "My spirit shall not strive with man forever" (Genesis 6:3).
