Not judgment and not any other matter, "My spirit shall not strive" - so that their soul shall not return to condemnation.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי מְנַחֵם בְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵף אוֹמֵר אֲפִילּוּ בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁהַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא מַחֲזִיר נְשָׁמוֹת לִפְגָרִים מֵתִים נִשְׁמָתָן קָשָׁה לָהֶם בְּגֵיהִנָּם שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר 'תַּהֲרוּ חֲשַׁשׁ תֵּלְדוּ קַשׁ רוּחֲכֶם אֵשׁ תֹּאכַלְכֶם'
human_translation: Rabbi Menaḥem, son of Rabbi Yosef, says: Even at a time when the Holy One, Blessed be He, restores souls to lifeless corpses, will them harshly in Gehenna, as it is stated: “You shall conceive chaff; you shall bring forth straw; your soul is a fire that shall devour you”
llm_translation: Rabbi Menachem, son of Rabbi Yosef, says: Even at the time when the Holy One, blessed be He, restores souls to dead bodies, their soul is difficult for them in Gehinnom, as it is stated, "You conceive chaff, you give birth to stubble; your spirit consumes you like fire."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן דּוֹר הַמַּבּוּל לֹא נִתְגָּאוּ אֶלָּא בִּשְׁבִיל טוֹבָה שֶׁהִשְׁפִּיעַ לָהֶם הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא וּמָה כְּתִיב בָּהֶם 'בָּתֵּיהֶם שָׁלוֹם מִפָּחַד וְלֹא שֵׁבֶט אֱלוֹהַּ עֲלֵיהֶם' וּכְתִיב 'שׁוֹרוֹ עִבַּר וְלֹא יַגְעִל תְּפַלֵּט פָּרָתוֹ וְלֹא תְשַׁכֵּל' וּכְתִיב 'יְשַׁלְּחוּ כַצֹּאן עֲוִילֵיהֶם וְיַלְדֵיהֶם יְרַקֵּדוּן' וּכְתִיב 'יִשְׂאוּ בְּתֹף וְכִנּוֹר וְיִשְׂמְחוּ לְקוֹל עוּגָב' וּכְתִיב 'יְכַלּוּ יְמֵיהֶם בַּטּוֹב וּשְׁנֵיהֶם בַּנְּעִימִים' וּכְתִיב 'וּבְרֶגַע שְׁאוֹל יֵחָתּוּ'
human_translation: The Sages taught The generation of the flood became haughty due only to the goodness that the Holy One, Blessed be He, bestowed upon them. And what is written concerning them, “Their houses are safe without fear, nor is the rod of God upon them” And it is written: “Their bull sires, and will not fall; their cow calves, and does not cast her calf” And it is written: “They send forth their little ones like a flock, and their children dance” And it is written: “They sing to the timbrel and harp, and rejoice at the sound of the pipe” And it is written: “They shall spend their days in prosperity, and their years in pleasures” And it is written: “And peacefully they go down to the grave”
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: The generation of the Flood did not become arrogant except due to the goodness that the Holy One, blessed be He, bestowed upon them. And what is written concerning them? "Their houses are at peace from fear, and the rod of God is not upon them." And it is written, "His bull breeds and does not fail; his cow calves and does not miscarry." And it is written, "They send forth their little ones like a flock, and their children dance." And it is written, "They take the timbrel and harp, and rejoice at the sound of the flute." And it is written, "They complete their days in prosperity, and their years in pleasantness." And it is written, "But in a moment, they are dismayed by Sheol."

hebrew_text: וְהִיא גָּרְמָה שֶׁאָמְרוּ לָאֵל 'סוּר מִמֶּנּוּ וְדַעַת דְּרָכֶיךָ לֹא חָפָצְנוּ מַה שַׁדַּי כִּי נַעַבְדֶנּוּ וּמַה נּוֹעִיל כִּי נִפְגַּע בּוֹ' אָמְרוּ 'כְּלוּם צְרִיכִין אָנוּ לוֹ אֶלָּא לְטִיפָּה שֶׁל גְּשָׁמִים יֵשׁ לָנוּ נְהָרוֹת וּמַעֲיָנוֹת שֶׁאָנוּ מִסְתַּפְּקִין מֵהֶן' אָמַר הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא 'בַּטּוֹבָה שֶׁהִשְׁפַּעְתִּי לָהֶן בָּהּ מַכְעִיסִין אוֹתִי וּבָהּ אֲנִי דָּן אוֹתָם' שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר 'וַאֲנִי הִנְנִי מֵבִיא אֶת הַמַּבּוּל מַיִם'
human_translation: And that caused to say to God: “Depart from us; for we desire not the knowledge of Your ways. What is the Almighty, that we should serve Him, and what profit should we have if we pray unto Him” said: Do we need Him for anything, even for drop of rain We have rivers and springs from which we take our supply The Holy One, Blessed be He, said: With the goodness that I bestowed upon them, with they infuriate Me and with it I will sentence them, as it is stated: “And behold I will bring the flood of water”
llm_translation: And it caused that they said to God, "Turn away from us, and we have no desire for knowledge of Your ways. What is the Almighty, that we should serve Him? And what profit should we have, if we pray to Him?" They said, "We have no need for Him at all, except for a drop of rain. We have rivers and springs from which we benefit." The Holy One, blessed be He, said, "With the good that I have bestowed upon them, they anger Me, and with it I will judge them." As it is said, "Behold, I will bring a flood of waters."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אָמַר דּוֹר הַמַּבּוּל לֹא נִתְגָּאוּ אֶלָּא בִּשְׁבִיל גַּלְגַּל הָעַיִן שֶׁדּוֹמֶה לְמַיִם [שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר 'וְיִקְחוּ לָהֶם נָשִׁים מִכֹּל אֲשֶׁר בְּחֹרוֹ'] לְפִיכָךְ דָּן אוֹתָן בְּמַיִם שֶׁדּוֹמֶה לְגַלְגַּל הָעַיִן שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר 'נִבְקְעוּ כׇּל מַעְיְנוֹת תְּהוֹם רַבָּה וַאֲרֻבּוֹת הַשָּׁמַיִם נִפְתָּחוּ'
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: The generation of the flood became haughty due only to the eyeball, which is similar to water, as it is stated: and they took for themselves wives from anyone they chose” Consequently, punished them with water, which is similar to an eyeball [ legalgal ha’ayin ], as it is stated: “All the fountains [ mayenot ] of the great deep were breached, and the flues of heaven were opened”
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei said: The generation of the Flood was only punished because of the wheel of the eye that resembles water, as it is stated, "And they took wives for themselves from all that they chose." Therefore, they are judged with water that resembles the wheel of the eye, as it is stated, "All the fountains of the great deep burst forth, and the floodgates of the sky were opened."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן דּוֹר הַמַּבּוּל בְּרַבָּה קִלְקְלוּ וּבְרַבָּה נִידּוֹנוּ בְּרַבָּה קִלְקְלוּ שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וַיַּרְא ה' כִּי רַבָּה רָעַת הָאָדָם וּבְרַבָּה נִידּוֹנוּ שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר כׇּל מַעְיְנוֹת תְּהוֹם רַבָּה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן שְׁלֹשָׁה נִשְׁתַּיְּירוּ מֵהֶם בְּלוּעָה דְּגָדֵר וְחַמֵּי טְבֶרְיָא וְעֵינָא רַבָּתִי דְּבֵירָם
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: the generation of the flood sinned with “great” and were punished with “great.” They sinned with “great,” as it is stated: “And the Lord saw that the wickedness of man was great” And they were punished with great, as it is stated: “All the fountains of the great deep Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Three of remained, Beloa of Gader, and the hot springs of Tiberias, and the great spring of Beiram.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: The generation of the Flood sinned greatly, and they were judged severely. They sinned greatly in that it is stated, "And the Lord saw that the wickedness of man was great upon the earth" (Genesis 6:5). And they were judged severely, as it is stated, "All the fountains of the great deep burst forth" (Genesis 7:11). Rabbi Yochanan said: Three things remained from them swallowed up by the earth – the boundary of the fish, the hot springs of Tiberias, and the great eye of the Temple.

hebrew_text: כִּי הִשְׁחִית כׇּל בָּשָׂר אֶת דַּרְכּוֹ עַל הָאָרֶץ אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהִרְבִּיעוּ בְּהֵמָה עַל חַיָּה וְחַיָּה עַל בְּהֵמָה וְהַכֹּל עַל אָדָם וְאָדָם עַל הַכֹּל אָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא בַּר כָּהֲנָא וְכוּלָּם חָזְרוּ חוּץ מִתּוּשְׁלְמִי
human_translation: “For all flesh had corrupted its way upon the earth” Rabbi Yoḥanan says: teaches that mated domesticated animals with undomesticated animals, and undomesticated animals with domesticated animals, and all with human and human with all Rabbi Abba bar Kahana says: And all of returned except tushlami ,
llm_translation: "When all flesh corrupted its way upon the earth," Rabbi Yochanan said: this teaches that they (the people) caused mixing of species, animal with animal, and animal with human, and all with humans. Rabbi Abba bar Kahana said: they all returned except for the Tushlami."

hebrew_text: וַיֹּאמֶר ה' לְנֹחַ קֵץ כׇּל בָּשָׂר בָּא לְפָנַי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֹּא וּרְאֵה כַּמָּה גָּדוֹל כֹּחַ שֶׁל חָמָס שֶׁהֲרֵי דּוֹר הַמַּבּוּל עָבְרוּ עַל הַכֹּל וְלֹא נֶחְתַּם עֲלֵיהֶם גְּזַר דִּינָם עַד שֶׁפָּשְׁטוּ יְדֵיהֶם בְּגָזֵל שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר כִּי מָלְאָה הָאָרֶץ חָמָס מִפְּנֵיהֶם וְהִנְנִי מַשְׁחִיתָם אֶת הָאָרֶץ וּכְתִיב הֶחָמָס קָם לְמַטֵּה רֶשַׁע לֹא מֵהֶם וְלֹא מֵהֲמוֹנָם וְלֹא מֶהֱמֵהֶם וְלֹא נֹהַּ בָּהֶם
human_translation: “And God said to Noah: The end of all flesh is come before Me, Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Come and see how great is the power of robbery, as the generation of the flood violated every but their sentence was not sealed until they extended their hands in robbery, as it is stated: “For the earth is filled with robbery through them, and behold, I will destroy them with the earth” And it is written: “Robbery is risen up into a rod of wickedness; nothing comes from them, nor from their multitude, nor from any of them, nor shall there be wailing [ no’ah ] for them”
llm_translation: And said the Lord to Noah, "The end of all flesh has come before Me." Rabbi Yochanan said, "Come and see how great is the power of robbery, for the generation of the Flood transgressed in all things, and judgment was not sealed upon them until they stretched forth their hands in robbery, as it is said, 'For the earth is filled with robbery because of them, and behold, I am going to destroy them with the earth.' And it is written, 'Violence has risen to be a rod of wickedness; it is not from them, nor from their multitude, nor from their tumult, nor is there a wailing for them.'"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר מְלַמֵּד שֶׁזָּקַף עַצְמוֹ כְּמַקֵּל וְעָמַד לִפְנֵי הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא וְאָמַר לְפָנָיו רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם לֹא מֵהֶם וְלֹא מֵהֲמוֹנָם וְלֹא מֶהֱמֵהֶם וְלֹא נֹהַּ בָּהֶם
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar says: teaches that straightened itself like a rod and stood before the Holy One, Blessed be He, and said before Him: Master of the Universe: “Nothing comes from them, nor from their multitude, nor from any of them, nor shall there be wailing for them,”
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: It teaches that he straightened himself like a staff and stood before the Holy One, blessed be He, and said before Him: "Master of the Universe, it is not from them, nor from their abundance, nor from their multitude, nor does it rest upon them."

hebrew_text: (וְאַף עַל נֹחַ נֶחְתַּם גְּזַר דִּין שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וְלֹא נֹחַ בָּהֶם) תָּנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל אַף עַל נֹחַ נֶחְתַּךְ גְּזַר דִּין אֶלָּא שֶׁמָּצָא חֵן בְּעֵינֵי ה' שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר 'נִחַמְתִּי כִּי עֲשִׂיתֶם וְנֹחַ מָצָא חֵן בְּעֵינֵי ה''
human_translation: And the sentence of Noah was also sealed; as it is stated: Nor shall there be No’aḥ for them. The school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: The sentence of Noah was also decided; but that he found favor in the eyes of God, as it is stated: “For I regret that I have made them. And Noah found favor in the eyes of the Lord”
llm_translation: "And even though Noah found favor in the eyes of the Lord, a decree of judgment was sealed against him, as it is stated, 'But Noah found favor in the eyes of the Lord.' It was taught in the school of Rabbi Ishmael: Even though Noah was sealed with a decree of judgment, it was only because he found favor in the eyes of the Lord, as it is stated, 'And the Lord regretted that He had made man on earth, and He was saddened in His heart.' And Noah found favor in the eyes of the Lord."

hebrew_text: וַיִּנָּחֶם ה' כִּי עָשָׂה אֶת הָאָדָם בָּאָרֶץ כִּי אֲתָא רַב דִּימִי אָמַר אָמַר הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא יָפֶה עָשִׂיתִי שֶׁתִּקַּנְתִּי לָהֶם קְבָרוֹת בָּאָרֶץ מַאי מַשְׁמַע כְּתִיב הָכָא וַיִּנָּחֶם ה' וּכְתִיב הָתָם וַיְנַחֵם אוֹתָם וַיְדַבֵּר עַל לִבָּם
human_translation: “ Vayyinaḥem the Lord that He made man on the earth [ ba’aretz ]” When Rav Dimi came he said The Holy One, Blessed be He, said: I did well that I prepared graves for in the earth [ ba’aretz ]. From where inferred It is written here: “ Vayyinaḥem ,” and it is written there: “And he comforted them [ vayenaḥem otam ] and spoke to their heart”
llm_translation: And the Lord relented because He made man on the earth. For Rav Dimi came and said: The Holy One, blessed be He, said, "I have done well in that I have provided them with graves in the earth." What is the meaning? It is written here, "And the Lord relented," and it is written there, "And He relented concerning them and spoke to their hearts."

hebrew_text: וְאִיכָּא דְאָמְרִי לֹא יָפֶה עָשִׂיתִי שֶׁתִּקַּנְתִּי לָהֶם קְבָרוֹת בָּאָרֶץ  כְּתִיב הָכָא וַיִּנָּחֶם וּכְתִיב הָתָם וַיִּנָּחֶם ה' עַל הָרָעָה אֲשֶׁר דִּבֶּר לַעֲשׂוֹת לְעַמּוֹ
human_translation: And there are who say I did not do well that I prepared graves for in the earth, It is written here: “ Vayyinaḥem ,” and it is written there: “And the Lord regretted [ vayyinaḥem ] the evil that He thought to do to His people”
llm_translation: And there are those who say, "It is not good that I have done, that I have acquired graves for them in the land." It is written here, "And He relented," and it is written there, "And the Lord relented from the evil that He had spoken of doing to His people."

hebrew_text: אֵלֶּה תּוֹלְדוֹת נֹחַ [נֹחַ אִישׁ צַדִּיק תָּמִים הָיָה בְּדֹרֹתָיו] אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בְּדוֹרוֹתָיו וְלֹא בְּדוֹרוֹת אֲחֵרִים וְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר בְּדוֹרוֹתָיו כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן בְּדוֹרוֹת אֲחֵרִים
human_translation: “These are the generations of Noah; Noah was a righteous man, and wholehearted in his generations” Rabbi Yoḥanan says: of his generation but not of other generations. And Reish Lakish says: In his generation all the more so in other generations.
llm_translation: These are the generations of Noah Noah was a righteous man, blameless in his generation. Rabbi Yochanan said: in his generations and not in other generations. And Reish Lakish said: in his generations, all the more so in other generations.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא מָשָׁל דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן לְמָה הַדָּבָר דּוֹמֶה  לְחָבִית שֶׁל יַיִן שֶׁהָיְתָה מוּנַּחַת בְּמַרְתֵּף שֶׁל חוֹמֶץ בִּמְקוֹמָהּ רֵיחָהּ נוֹדֵף שֶׁלֹּא בִּמְקוֹמָהּ  אֵין רֵיחָהּ נוֹדֵף אָמַר רַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא מָשָׁל דְּרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ לְמָה הַדָּבָר דּוֹמֶה  לִצְלוֹחִית שֶׁל פִּלְיָיטוֹן שֶׁהָיְתָה מוּנַּחַת בִּמְקוֹם הַטִּנּוֹפֶת בִּמְקוֹמָהּ רֵיחָהּ נוֹדֵף וְכׇל שֶׁכֵּן בִּמְקוֹם הַבּוֹסֶם
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina says: a parable of Rabbi Yoḥanan; to what is this matter comparable? to a barrel of wine that was placed in a cellar vinegar in its place, its fragrance diffuses, not in its place its fragrance does not diffuse, Rabbi Oshaya says: a parable of Reish Lakish; to what is this matter comparable? to a flask of perfume [ palyaton ] that was placed in a location of filth. In its place its fragrance diffuses and all the more so in a location perfume.
llm_translation: Rabbi Chanina said: A parable of Rabbi Yochanan - What is the matter comparable to? To a cask of wine that was placed in a room of vinegar, in its place its scent is dispersed, but not in its place, its scent is not dispersed. Rabbi Oshaya said: A parable of Reish Lakish - What is the matter comparable to? To a flask of balsam oil that was placed in a place of tanning, in its place its scent is dispersed, and all the more so in a place of balsam.

hebrew_text: וַיִּמַח אֶת כׇּל הַיְקוּם אֲשֶׁר עַל פְּנֵי הָאֲדָמָה אִם אָדָם חָטָא בְּהֵמָה מָה חָטְאָה
human_translation: “And He obliterated every living thing that was upon the face of the ground, If man sinned, what did animal sin
llm_translation: And he blotted out all the living beings that were upon the face of the ground, whether man or beast, what did the beast sin?

hebrew_text: תָּנָא מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן קׇרְחָה מָשָׁל לְאָדָם שֶׁעָשָׂה חוּפָּה לִבְנוֹ וְהִתְקִין מִכׇּל מִינֵי סְעוּדָה לְיָמִים מֵת בְּנוֹ עָמַד וּבִלְבֵּל אֶת חוּפָּתוֹ אָמַר 'כְּלוּם עָשִׂיתִי אֶלָּא בִּשְׁבִיל בְּנִי עַכְשָׁיו שֶׁמֵּת חוּפָּה לָמָּה לִי' אַף הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא אָמַר 'כְּלוּם בָּרָאתִי בְּהֵמָה וְחַיָּה אֶלָּא בִּשְׁבִיל אָדָם עַכְשָׁיו שֶׁאָדָם חוֹטֵא בְּהֵמָה וְחַיָּה לָמָּה לִי'
human_translation: taught in the name of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korḥa: a parable to a man who fashioned a wedding canopy for his son and prepared all sorts of feast. Sometime his son died. He arose and dismantled his wedding canopy. He said: Did I do other than for my son? Now that died, why do I a wedding canopy? So too, the Holy One, Blessed be He, said: Did I create domesticated animals and non-domesticated animals other than for man? Now that man sins why do I domesticated animals and non-domesticated animals?
llm_translation: It was taught in the name of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korcha: A parable for a person who made a wedding feast for his son and prepared all kinds of delicacies for many days. When his son died, he stood up and confused his feast, saying, "I have done nothing except for my son who has now died. Why do I need a wedding feast?" So too, the Holy One, blessed be He, said, "I have created nothing but animals and beasts except for man. Now that man sins, why do I need animals and beasts?"

hebrew_text: מִכֹּל אֲשֶׁר בֶּחָרָבָה מֵתוּ וְלֹא דָּגִים שֶׁבַּיָּם
human_translation: “Of all that was on dry land died” But not the fish that are in the sea,
llm_translation: From all that in the sword died and not fish in the sea.

hebrew_text: דָּרֵשׁ רַבִּי יוֹסֵי דְּמִן קֵסָרִי מַאי דִּכְתִיב קַל הוּא עַל פְּנֵי מַיִם תְּקֻלַּל חֶלְקָתָם בָּאָרֶץ מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהָיָה נֹחַ הַצַּדִּיק מוֹכִיחַ בָּהֶם וְאוֹמֵר לָהֶם עֲשׂוּ תְּשׁוּבָה וְאִם לָאו הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא מֵבִיא עֲלֵיכֶם אֶת הַמַּבּוּל וּמַקְפֶּה נִבְלַתְכֶם עַל הַמַּיִם כְּזִיקִין שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר 'קַל הוּא עַל פְּנֵי מַיִם' וְלֹא עוֹד אֶלָּא שֶׁלּוֹקְחִין מֵהֶם קְלָלָה לְכׇל בָּאֵי עוֹלָם שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר תְּקֻלַּל חֶלְקָתָם בָּאָרֶץ
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei from Caesarea taught: What which is written: “He is swift upon the face of the waters; their portion is cursed in the earth; teaches that Noah the righteous would rebuke and say to them: Repent. And if not, the Holy One, Blessed be He, will bring a flood upon you and float your corpses on the water like wineskins as it is stated: “He is swift upon the face of the waters.” Moreover, a curse is taken from them to all who enter the world, As it is stated: “Their portion is cursed in the earth.”
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei sought from Caesarea: What is the meaning of what is written, "Light is upon the face of the waters, their portion is cursed in the land"? This teaches that Noah, the righteous, would rebuke them and say to them, "Repent! And if not, the Holy One, blessed be He, will bring upon you the flood and will float your carcasses on the water like gourds," as it is said, "Light is upon the face of the waters." Moreover, they would take a curse from them for all generations, as it is said, "Their portion is cursed in the land."

hebrew_text: לֹא יִפְנֶה דֶּרֶךְ כְּרָמִים מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהָיוּ מְפַנִּים דֶּרֶךְ כְּרָמִים אָמְרוּ לוֹ וּמִי מְעַכֵּב אָמַר לָהֶם פְּרֵידָה אַחַת יֵשׁ לִי לְהוֹצִיא מִכֶּם
human_translation: “He turns not by way of the vineyards,” teaches that they would clear a path through vineyards. They said to And who is preventing said to them: I have one pigeon, remove from among you
llm_translation: He should not turn aside the path of vineyards, teaching that they were turning aside the path of vineyards. They said to him, "Who is delaying you?" He said to them, "I have one grape cluster to bring out from among you."

hebrew_text: אִם כֵּן לֹא נְפַנֶּה דֶּרֶךְ כְּרָמִים
human_translation: If so we will not clear a path through vineyards,
llm_translation: If so, we will not turn the path of vineyards.

hebrew_text: דָּרֵשׁ רָבָא מַאי דִּכְתִיב לַפִּיד בּוּז לְעַשְׁתּוּת שַׁאֲנָן נָכוֹן לְמוֹעֲדֵי רָגֶל מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהָיָה נֹחַ הַצַּדִּיק מוֹכִיחַ אוֹתָם וְאָמַר לָהֶם דְּבָרִים שֶׁהֵם קָשִׁים כְּלַפִּידִים וְהָיוּ בּוֹזִים אוֹתוֹ אָמְרוּ לוֹ זָקֵן תֵּיבָה זוֹ לָמָּה אָמַר לָהֶם הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא מֵבִיא עֲלֵיכֶם אֶת הַמַּבּוּל אָמְרוּ מַבּוּל שֶׁל מָה אִם מַבּוּל שֶׁל אֵשׁ יֵשׁ לָנוּ דָּבָר אֶחָד וַעֲלִיתָה שְׁמָהּ וְאִם שֶׁל מַיִם הוּא מֵבִיא אִם מִן הָאָרֶץ הוּא מֵבִיא יֵשׁ לָנוּ עֲשָׁשִׁיּוֹת שֶׁל בַּרְזֶל שֶׁאָנוּ מְחַפִּין בָּהֶם אֶת הָאָרֶץ וְאִם מִן הַשָּׁמַיִם הוּא מֵבִיא יֵשׁ לָנוּ דָּבָר וְעָקֵב שְׁמוֹ וְאָמְרִי לַהּ עִקֵּשׁ שְׁמוֹ
human_translation: Rava taught: What which is written: “A contemptible torch [ lapid ] in the thought of him that is at ease, a thing ready for them whose foot slips” teaches that Noah the righteous would rebuke and he said to them statements that are harsh as torches [ kelapidim ], and they would treat him with contempt. They said to him: Old man, why this ark? said to them: The Holy One, Blessed be He, is bringing a flood upon you. They said to him: A flood of what? If it is a flood of fire, we have another item and it is called alita , And if of water He brings, if He brings from the earth, we have iron plates with which we plate the earth And if He brings from the heavens, we have an item and it is called ekev , and some say it is called ikkesh ,
llm_translation: Rava sought: What is the meaning of what is written, "For a lamp is a disgrace to the lawless, and it is fit for the feet of the righteous" (Proverbs 13:9)? This teaches that he Noah was rebuking them his generation concerning the appointed times of pilgrimage. He would reprove them and say to them words that are as hard as flint, and they would scorn him. They said to him, "Old man, for what is this ark?" He said to them, "The Holy One, blessed be He, will bring upon you the Flood." They said, "A flood of what? If it is a flood of fire, we have one thing to counter it, and you will ascend and dwell there. And if it is a flood of water, if it comes from the earth, we have iron plates with which we can cover the earth. And if it comes from the sky, we have a thing called 'Akev' and we will say to it, 'Your name is twisted.'"

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָהֶם הוּא מֵבִיא מִבֵּין עִקְּבֵי רַגְלֵיכֶם שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר 'נָכוֹן לְמוֹעֲדֵי רָגֶל' תַּנְיָא מֵימֵי הַמַּבּוּל קָשִׁים כְּשִׁכְבַת זֶרַע שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר 'נָכוֹן לְמוֹעֲדֵי רָגֶל' אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא בְּרוֹתְחִין קִלְקְלוּ בַּעֲבֵירָה וּבְרוֹתְחִין נִידּוֹנוּ  כְּתִיב הָכָא וַיָּשֹׁכּוּ הַמָּיִם וּכְתִיב הָתָם וַחֲמַת הַמֶּלֶךְ שָׁכָכָה
human_translation: said to them: He will bring from between your feet as it is stated: “For them whose foot slips.” It is taught The waters of the flood were hard as semen, as it is stated: “For them whose foot slips”; Rav Ḥisda says: With hot they sinned, and with hot they were punished. it is written here, “And the waters assuaged” and it is written there: “Then the king’s wrath was assuaged”
llm_translation: He said to them, "He brings from between the heels of your feet," as it is stated, "Ready for the appointed times of the feet." It was taught: From the days of the flood, they are as difficult as the emission of seed, as it is stated, "Ready for the appointed times of the feet." Rav Ḥisdah said: With boiling water they sinned, and with boiling water they were judged. It is written here, "And the waters subsided," and it is written there, "And the king's wrath subsided."

hebrew_text: וַיְהִי לְשִׁבְעַת הַיָּמִים וּמֵי הַמַּבּוּל הָיוּ עַל הָאָרֶץ מָה טִיבָם שֶׁל שִׁבְעַת הַיָּמִים
human_translation: “And it came to pass that after seven days the waters of the flood were upon the earth” What is the nature of seven days?
llm_translation: And it was for seven of the days, and the waters of the flood were upon the earth. What was their goodness of the seven of the days.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אֵלּוּ יְמֵי אֲבֵילוּת שֶׁל מְתוּשֶׁלַח לְלַמֶּדְךָ שֶׁהֶסְפֵּדָן שֶׁל צַדִּיקִים מְעַכְּבִין אֶת הַפּוּרְעָנוּת לָבֹא דָּבָר אַחֵר לְשִׁבְעַת [הַיָּמִים] שֶׁשִּׁינָּה עֲלֵיהֶם הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא סֵדֶר בְּרֵאשִׁית שֶׁהָיְתָה חַמָּה יוֹצֵאת מִמַּעֲרָב וְשׁוֹקַעַת בַּמִּזְרָח דָּבָר אַחֵר שֶׁקָּבַע לָהֶם הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא זְמַן גָּדוֹל וְאַחַר כָּךְ זְמַן קָטָן דָּבָר אַחֵר לְשִׁבְעַת הַיָּמִים שֶׁהִטְעִימָם מֵעֵין הָעוֹלָם הַבָּא כְּדֵי שֶׁיֵּדְעוּ מָה טוֹבָה מָנְעוּ מֵהֶן
human_translation: Rav says: These were the days of mourning of Methuselah; to teach you that eulogies for the righteous prevent calamities from ensuing. Alternatively, “after seven that the Holy One, Blessed be He, altered the order of Creation for that the sun would emerge in the west and set in the east. Alternatively, that the Holy One, Blessed be He, designated a substantial period for them, and thereafter a brief period Alternatively, “after seven days” that gave them a foretaste of the World-to-Come, so that they would know what munificence prevented them from
llm_translation: Rav said: These are the days of mourning for Methuselah, to teach you that the eulogies of the righteous delay retribution. Another matter, for the seven days that the Holy One, blessed be He, changed the order of creation, when the sun used to set in the west and rise in the east. Another matter, that the Holy One, blessed be He, appointed for them a long time, and afterwards a short time. Another matter, for the seven days that He sweetened their taste from the World to Come, so that they would know what goodness they had been deprived of.

hebrew_text: מִכֹּל הַבְּהֵמָה הַטְּהוֹרָה תִּקַּח לְךָ שִׁבְעָה שִׁבְעָה אִישׁ וְאִשְׁתּוֹ אִישׁוּת לִבְהֵמָה מִי אִית לַהּ אָמַר רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן מֵאוֹתָם שֶׁלֹּא נֶעֶבְדָה בָּהֶם עֲבֵירָה
human_translation: “Of every kosher animal you shall take to you by sevens, husband and wife” Is there marriage for animals? Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani says Rabbi Yonatan says: those with which transgression was not performed.
llm_translation: From all the clean animal you shall take for yourself seven seven man and his wife coupling of animal who is to him said Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said Rabbi Yonatan from those that not been served in them transgression.

hebrew_text: מְנָא יְדַע אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא שֶׁהֶעֱבִירָן לִפְנֵי הַתֵּיבָה כֹּל שֶׁהַתֵּיבָה קוֹלַטְתּוֹ  בְּיָדוּעַ שֶׁלֹּא נֶעֶבְדָה בָּהֶם עֲבֵירָה וְכֹל שֶׁאֵין הַתֵּיבָה קוֹלַטְתּוֹ  בְּיָדוּעַ שֶׁנֶּעֶבְדָה בָּהּ עֲבֵירָה רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ אָמַר מֵאוֹתָן הַבָּאִין מֵאֵילֵיהֶן
human_translation: From where did know Rav Ḥisda says: He passed them before the ark. All that the ark accepted, it was known that a transgression had not been performed with them. And any that the ark did not accept, it was known that a transgression had been performed with it. Rabbi Abbahu says: from those that came on their own,
llm_translation: Mena Yeda Amar Rav Chisda shehe'eviran lifnei ha'teivah kol sheha'teivah koltato beyadua shelo ne'evdah bahem aveirah ve'kol she'ein ha'teivah koltato beyadua shene'evdah bah aveirah Rabbi Avahu amar me'otan haba'im me'eileihen.

hebrew_text: עֲשֵׂה לְךָ תֵּבַת עֲצֵי גֹפֶר מַאי גּוֹפֶר אָמַר רַב אַדָּא אָמְרִי דְּבֵי רַבִּי שֵׁילָא זוֹ מַבְלִיגָה וְאָמְרִי לַהּ גּוּלְמֵישׁ
human_translation: “Make you an ark of gopher wood” What gopher Rav Adda says they say in the school of Rabbi Sheila: This mavliga and some say willow [ gulamish ]
llm_translation: Make for yourself an ark of gopher wood. What is "gopher"? Rav Adda said, the household of Rabbi Sheila said: this is a type of wood. And some say: it is a type of cedar.

hebrew_text: צֹהַר תַּעֲשֶׂה לַתֵּבָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר לוֹ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לְנֹחַ קְבַע בָּהּ אֲבָנִים טוֹבוֹת וּמַרְגָּלִיּוֹת כְּדֵי שֶׁיִּהְיוּ מְאִירוֹת לָכֶם כַּצׇּהֳרַיִם
human_translation: “A tzohar you shall make for the ark” Rabbi Yoḥanan says the Holy One, Blessed be He, said to Noah: Set precious stones and jewels in so that they will shine for you as the afternoon [ tzohorayim ]
llm_translation: "Window make for the ark," said Rabbi Yochanan said to him the Holy One, blessed be He, to Noah, 'Fix in it good stones and crystals so that they will illuminate for you like the noon.'"

hebrew_text: וְאֶל אַמָּה תְּכַלֶּנָּה מִלְמַעְלָה דִּבְהָכִי [הוּא] דְּקָיְימָא
human_translation: “And to a cubit you shall finish it above” that in that manner, stand
llm_translation: And to an amah they shall finish from above, as it is established.

hebrew_text: תַּחְתִּיִּם שְׁנִיִּם וּשְׁלִשִׁים תַּעֲשֶׂהָ תָּנָא תַּחְתִּיִּים לְזֶבֶל אֶמְצָעִיִּים לַבְּהֵמָה עֶלְיוֹנִים לָאָדָם
human_translation: “With lower, second and third stories shall you make it” taught The bottom for manure, the middle for animals, and the top for people.
llm_translation: Underneath two and thirty you shall make it. A Tanna taught: Underneath two for refuse, middle for animals, uppermost for humans.

hebrew_text: וַיְשַׁלַּח אֶת הָעֹרֵב אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ תְּשׁוּבָה נִיצַּחַת הֱשִׁיבוֹ עוֹרֵב לְנֹחַ אָמַר לוֹ רַבְּךָ שׂוֹנְאֵנִי וְאַתָּה שְׂנֵאתָנִי רַבְּךָ שׂוֹנְאֵנִי  מִן הַטְּהוֹרִין שִׁבְעָה מִן הַטְּמֵאִים שְׁנַיִם וְאַתָּה שְׂנֵאתָנִי  שֶׁאַתָּה מַנִּיחַ מִמִּין שִׁבְעָה וְשׁוֹלֵחַ מִמִּין שְׁנַיִם אִם פּוֹגֵעַ בִּי שַׂר חַמָּה אוֹ שַׂר צִנָּה לֹא נִמְצָא עוֹלָם חָסֵר בְּרִיָּה אַחַת אוֹ שֶׁמָּא לְאִשְׁתִּי אַתָּה צָרִיךְ
human_translation: “And he sent forth the raven, Reish Lakish says: The raven a convincing response to Noah; said to him: Your Master, hates me, and you hate me. Your Master hates me, from the kosher seven from the non-kosher two. And you hate me, as you disregard from the species of seven, and dispatch from the species of two, If the angel of heat or the angel of cold harms me will the world not be lacking one creature, Or perhaps my wife you need,
llm_translation: He sent the raven. Reish Lakish said: "Repentance has prevailed." The raven returned to Noah. It said to him: "Your master hates me, and you hate me. Your master hates me - seven from the clean, two from the unclean. And you hate me - for you leave seven of my kind and send away two. If a minister of heat or a minister of cold strikes me, the world will not find a creature lacking, or perhaps you need it for your wife."

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ רָשָׁע בַּמּוּתָּר לִי נֶאֱסַר לִי בַּנֶּאֱסָר לִי לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן
human_translation: said to Wicked one! with who is permitted to me, is forbidden to me, with which are forbidden to me, not all the more so
llm_translation: He said to him: "In the permitted it is forbidden to me, in the forbidden it is forbidden to me, certainly not."

hebrew_text: וּמְנָלַן דְּנֶאֶסְרוּ דִּכְתִיב וּבָאתָ אֶל הַתֵּבָה אַתָּה וּבָנֶיךָ וְאִשְׁתְּךָ וּנְשֵׁי בָנֶיךָ אִתָּךְ וּכְתִיב צֵא מִן הַתֵּבָה אַתָּה וְאִשְׁתְּךָ וּבָנֶיךָ וּנְשֵׁי בָנֶיךָ אִתָּךְ וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִיכָּן (אָמְרוּ) שֶׁנֶּאֶסְרוּ בְּתַשְׁמִישׁ הַמִּטָּה
human_translation: And from where do we that it was prohibited which is written: “And you shall come into the ark, you, and your sons, and your wife, and your sons’ wives with you” and it is written: “Emerge from the ark, you and your wife, and your sons and your sons’ wives with you” And Rabbi Yoḥanan says: From here, said that it was prohibited in intercourse
llm_translation: And from where do we derive that they were prohibited? As it is written, "And you shall enter the ark, you and your sons and your wife, and your sons' wives with you" (Genesis 6:18), and it is written, "Go out of the ark, you and your wife, and your sons and your sons' wives with you" (Genesis 8:16). And Rabbi Yochanan said: From here they said that they were prohibited in marital relations.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן שְׁלֹשָׁה שִׁמְּשׁוּ בַּתֵּיבָה וְכוּלָּם לָקוּ כֶּלֶב וְעוֹרֵב וְחָם כֶּלֶב נִקְשַׁר עוֹרֵב רָק חָם לָקָה בְּעוֹרוֹ
human_translation: The Sages taught: Three engaged in intercourse in the ark, and all of them were punished dog, and raven, and Ham, dog is bound; raven spits, Ham was afflicted in his skin
llm_translation: The sages taught: three who served in the synagogue, and all of them were bitten - a dog, a raven, and a weasel. The dog was tied, the raven pecked, and the weasel was scorched in its skin.

hebrew_text: וַיְשַׁלַּח אֶת הַיּוֹנָה מֵאִתּוֹ לִרְאוֹת הֲקַלּוּ הַמַּיִם אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה מִכָּאן שֶׁדִּירָתָן שֶׁל עוֹפוֹת טְהוֹרִים עִם הַצַּדִּיקִים
human_translation: “And he sent forth the dove from him, to see if the waters abated” Rabbi Yirmeya says: From here that the dwelling place of kosher birds with the righteous
llm_translation: And he sent the dove from him to see if the waters had subsided. Rabbi Yirmeya said: From here it is inferred that the dwelling place of pure birds is with the righteous.

hebrew_text: וְהִנֵּה עֲלֵה זַיִת טָרָף בְּפִיהָ אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אָמְרָה יוֹנָה לִפְנֵי הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם יִהְיוּ מְזוֹנוֹתַי מְרוֹרִים כְּזַיִת וּמְסוּרִים בְּיָדְךָ וְאַל יִהְיוּ מְתוּקִים כִּדְבַשׁ וּמְסוּרִים בְּיַד בָּשָׂר וָדָם מַאי מַשְׁמַע דְּהַאי טָרָף לִישָּׁנָא דִּמְזוֹנֵי הוּא דִּכְתִיב הַטְרִיפֵנִי לֶחֶם חֻקִּי
human_translation: “And in her mouth was an olive branch plucked off [ taraf ]” Rabbi Elazar says: dove said before the Holy One, Blessed be He: Master of the Universe, may my sustenance be bitter as the olive and dependent on Your hands, and not sweet as honey and dependent on the hands of flesh and blood. From where may be inferred that taraf is a term sustenance? which is written: “Feed me [ hatrifeni ] with my allotted portion”
llm_translation: And behold, an olive leaf was torn in its mouth. Rabbi Elazar said: The dove said before the Holy One, blessed be He: "Master of the world, may my sustenance be bitter like an olive and placed in Your hand, and not be sweet like honey and placed in the hand of flesh and blood." What is the implication of this torn leaf? It is in reference to sustenance, as it is written, "Break my bread for me."

hebrew_text: לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתֵיהֶם יָצְאוּ מִן הַתֵּבָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן לְמִשְׁפְּחוֹתָם וְלֹא הֵם
human_translation: “After their kinds [ lemishpeḥoteihem ], they emerged from the ark” Rabbi Yoḥanan says: After their kinds [ lemishpeḥotam ] but not them [ hem ]
llm_translation: Families their went out from the ark, said Rabbi Yochanan, to their families and not they.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חָנָא בַּר בִּיזְנָא אָמַר לֵיהּ אֱלִיעֶזֶר לְשֵׁם רַבָּא כְּתִיב 'לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתֵיהֶם יָצְאוּ מִן הַתֵּבָה' אַתּוּן הֵיכָן הֲוֵיתוּן אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ צַעַר גָּדוֹל הָיָה לָנוּ בַּתֵּיבָה בְּרִיָּה שֶׁדַּרְכָּהּ לְהַאֲכִילָהּ בַּיּוֹם  הֶאֱכַלְנוּהָ בַּיּוֹם שֶׁדַּרְכָּהּ לְהַאֲכִילָהּ בַּלַּיְלָה  הֶאֱכַלְנוּהָ בַּלַּיְלָה הַאי זְקִיתָא לָא הֲוָה יָדַע אַבָּא מָה אָכְלָה יוֹמָא חַד הֲוָה יָתֵיב וְקָא פָאלֵי רִמּוֹנָא נְפַל תּוֹלַעְתָּא מִינַּהּ אֲכַלָה מִיכָּן וְאֵילָךְ הֲוָה גָּבֵיל לַהּ חִיזְרָא כִּי מַתְלַע אָכְלָה
human_translation: Rav Ḥana bar Bizna says: Eliezer, said to Shem the Great, It is written: “After their kinds, they emerged from the ark,” Where were you said to him: We great suffering in the ark a creature that one typically feeds during the day, we fed it during the day, that one typically feeds at night, we fed it at night. that chameleon, my father did not know what it eats. One day, was sitting and peeling a pomegranate. A worm fell from it ate it. From that point forward would knead bran when it became overrun with worms, eat
llm_translation: Rav Ḥanina bar Bizna said that Eliezer said to Rava: It is written, "From their families they emerged from the ark." Where were they? They said to him: It was a great distress for us in the ark, a creature whose way was to eat during the day, we fed it during the day, and a creature whose way was to eat at night, we fed it at night. This old lady did not know what she ate on one day; she was sitting and weaving a pomegranate, a worm fell from it, she ate it from there and onwards she was bound to it, for once she tasted it, she continued to eat it.

hebrew_text: אַרְיָא אֶישָּׁתָא זַנְתֵּיהּ דְּאָמַר רַב לָא בְּצִיר מִשִּׁיתָּא וְלָא טְפֵי מִתְּרֵיסַר זָיְנָא אִישָּׁתָא אוּרְשִׁינָה (אַשְׁכְּחִינֵיהּ) [אַשְׁכְּחֵיהּ] אַבָּא דְּגָנֵי בְּסַפְנָא דְּתֵיבוֹתָא אֲמַר לֵיהּ לָא בָּעֵית מְזוֹנֵי' אֲמַר לֵיהּ חֲזֵיתָיךְ דַּהֲוֵת טְרִידַתְּ אָמֵינָא לָא אֲצַעֲרָךְ' אֲמַר לֵיהּ יְהֵא רַעֲוָא דְּלָא תְּמוּת שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וָאֹמַר עִם קִנִּי אֶגְוָע וְכַחוֹל אַרְבֶּה יָמִים'
human_translation: the lion, a fever sustained it, as Rav said: no fewer than six and no more than twelve fever sustains phoenix [ avarshina ], my father found it lying in the side of the ark. He said to Do you not want food? said to him: I saw that you were busy, I said I would not trouble you said to May it be will that you shall not die, as it is stated: “And I said, I shall die in my nest, and I shall multiply my days as the phoenix”
llm_translation: The lion, the husband of his wife, who said Rav not in the harvest from the sixth, and not more than thirteen, the husband of a woman, he found the father of the granaries in the ship of the boats, he said to him, "You do not want sustenance?" He said to him, "Have you seen that you were troubled? I will not distress you." He said to him, "May the evil not die, as it is said, 'I said, I will die with my nest, and I will multiply my days like the sand.'"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חָנָה בַּר לֵוַאי אֲמַר שֵׁם רַבָּא לֶאֱלִיעֶזֶר כִּי אֲתוֹ עֲלַיְיכוּ מַלְכֵי מִזְרָח וּמַעֲרָב אַתּוּן הֵיכִי עֲבְידִיתוּ אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַיְיתִי הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לְאַבְרָהָם וְאוֹתְבֵיהּ מִיַּמִּינֵיהּ וַהֲוָה שָׁדֵינַן עַפְרָא וְהָווּ חַרְבֵי גִּילֵי וְהָווּ גִּירֵי שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר מִזְמוֹר לְדָוִד נְאֻם ה' לַאדֹנִי שֵׁב לִימִינִי עַד אָשִׁית אֹיְבֶיךָ הֲדֹם לְרַגְלֶיךָ' וּכְתִיב מִי הֵעִיר מִמִּזְרָח צֶדֶק יִקְרָאֵהוּ לְרַגְלוֹ יִתֵּן לְפָנָיו גּוֹיִם וּמְלָכִים יַרְדְּ יִתֵּן כֶּעָפָר חַרְבּוֹ כְּקַשׁ נִדָּף קַשְׁתּוֹ'
human_translation: Rav Ḥana bar Leva’ei says Shem the Great said to Eliezer, When kings of the east and the west came upon you what did you do? said to him: The Holy One, Blessed be He, brought Abraham and placed him to His right, and we would throw dust and it became swords, straw and it became arrows, as it is stated: “A Psalm of David. The Lord says to my master: Sit to My right, until I make your enemies your footstool” and it is written: “Who has raised up one from the east at whose steps victory attends? He gives nations before him, and makes him rule over kings; his sword makes them as the dust, his bow as driven straw”
llm_translation: Rav Ḥanah son of Levi said: Shem Rava said to Eli'ezer, "When the kings of the east and west come upon you, what will you do?" He said to him, "I brought the Holy One, blessed be He, to Abraham, and He surrounded him with clouds of dust, and they became sharp swords, and they became arrows, as it is stated: 'A psalm of David. The word of the Lord to my master: "Sit at My right hand, until I make your enemies your footstool."' And it is written: 'Who aroused from the east one who calls him to his foot? He delivers nations before him, and subdues kings. He makes them like dust with his sword, like driven stubble with his bow.'"

hebrew_text: נַחוּם אִישׁ גַּם זוֹ הֲוָה רְגִיל דְּכֹל דַּהֲוָה סָלְקָא לֵיהּ אֲמַר גַּם זוֹ לְטוֹבָה יוֹמָא חַד בְּעוֹ [יִשְׂרָאֵל] לְשַׁדּוֹרֵי דּוֹרוֹן לְקֵיסָר אָמְרִי בַּהֲדֵי
human_translation: Naḥum of Gam Zo was accustomed that any that arose in his would say: This too [ gam zo ] is for the best. One day the Jewish people sought to send a gift [ doron ] to the emperor. They said: With
llm_translation: Nahum Ish Gam Zo Hava Regel De'chol Dahava Salka Lei Amar Gam Zo Le'tovah Yoma Chad Be'o Yisrael L'shadorai Doro L'Keisar Amri Bahadei

hebrew_text: מַאן נְשַׁדַּר נְשַׁדַּר בַּהֲדֵי נַחוּם אִישׁ גַּם זוֹ דִּמְלוּמָּד בְּנִסִּים הוּא
human_translation: whom shall we send We will send with Naḥum of Gam Zo, as he is experienced in miracles.
llm_translation: Whoever is needed, let him be needed in the presence of Nahum Ish Gam Zo Dimlummad B'Nissim Hu.

hebrew_text: כִּי מְטָא לְהָהוּא דִּיּוּרָא בְּעָא לְמֵיבַת אָמְרִי לֵיהּ מַאי אִיכָּא בַּהֲדָךְ אֲמַר לְהוּ קָא מוֹבֵילְנָא כְּרָגָא לְקֵיסָר קָמוּ בְּלֵילְיָא שְׁרֹינְהוּ לְסִיפְטֵיהּ וּשְׁקַלוּ כֹּל דַּהֲוָה גַּבֵּיהּ וּמַלֹּנְהוּ עַפְרָא כִּי מְטָא לְהָתָם אִישְׁתְּכַח עַפְרָא אֲמַר אַחוֹכֵי קָא מְחַיְּיכִי בִּי יְהוּדָאֵי אַפְּקוּהּ לְמִקְטְלֵיהּ אֲמַר גַּם זוֹ לְטוֹבָה אֲתָא אֵלִיָּהוּ וְאִידְּמִי לְהוּ כְּחַד מִינַּיְיהוּ אֲמַר לְהוּ דִּילְמָא הַאי עַפְרָא מֵעַפְרָא דְּאַבְרָהָם אָבִינוּ הוּא דַּהֲוָה שָׁדֵי עַפְרָא הָווּ חַרְבֵי גִּילֵי הָווּ גִּירֵי בְּדוּק וְאַשְׁכַּחוּ הָכִי
human_translation: When he reached a certain lodging, he sought to sleep said to him: What have with you? said to them: I am taking the head tax to the emperor. They rose in the night, opened his chest and took everything that was in it, and filled with dirt. When he arrived there, earth was discovered said: The Jews are mocking me They took out to kill him. said: This too is for the best. Elijah came and appeared to them as one of said to them: Perhaps this earth is from the earth of Abraham our forefather, who would throw dust it became swords, straw it became arrows. They examined and discovered
llm_translation: When he came to the inn, he wanted to enter. They said to him, "What is in your hand?" He said to them, "We are bringing a gift to Caesar." They arose in the middle of the night, sharpened their knives, and took everything that was on his back and filled it with dust. When he arrived there, he found dust in his bag. He said, "I am being mocked by the Jews." I will go and kill them." He said, "This too is for the good." Elijah came and appeared to them like one of them. He said to them, "Perhaps this dust is from the dust of our father Abraham, who used to throw dust at the idolaters. They would become like coals of fire and arrows of lightning, and they would find it so."

hebrew_text: הֲוָה מָחוֹזָא דְּלָא הֲווֹ קָא יָכְלִי לֵיהּ לְמִיכְבְּשֵׁיהּ שְׁדוֹ מֵהָהוּא עַפְרָא עֲלֵיהּ וְכַבְשׁוּהּ עַיְּילוּהּ לְבֵי גִנְזָא אָמְרִי שְׁקוֹל דְּנִיחָא לָךְ מַלְּיֵיהּ לְסִיפְטָא דַּהֲבָא כִּי הֲדַר אֲתָא אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ הָנָךְ דָּיּוֹרֵי מַאי אַמְטֵית לְבֵי מַלְכָּא אֲמַר לְהוּ מַאי דִּשְׁקַלִי מֵהָכָא אַמְטַאי לְהָתָם שָׁקְלִי אִינְהוּ אַמְטוֹ לְהָתָם קַטְלִינְהוּ לְהָנָךְ דָּיוֹרֵי
human_translation: There was a province that were unable to conquer. They threw of this earth upon and they conquered it. they brought him into the treasury said: Take which is preferable to you. He filled his chest gold. When he returned those residents said to him: What did you bring to the king’s palace? said to them: What I took from here, I brought to there. They took brought it to they executed those residents.
llm_translation: The courtyard that was not able to contain it, they spread dirt from that dust on it, and they contained it. They brought it into the treasury house. They said, "Take your fill, for it is yours." When the time came for it to return, they said to it, "You are sufficient for the king's house." It said to them, "What did you take from here?" They replied, "We took it to there." They took it to there, and they killed it for the courtyard that was able to contain it.

hebrew_text: דּוֹר הַפְּלַגָּה אֵין לָהֶם חֵלֶק לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא וְכוּ' מַאי עֲבוּד אָמְרִי דְּבֵי רַבִּי שֵׁילָא נִבְנֶה מִגְדָּל וְנַעֲלֶה לָרָקִיעַ וְנַכֶּה אוֹתוֹ בְּקַרְדּוּמּוֹת כְּדֵי שֶׁיָּזוּבוּ מֵימָיו מַחֲכוּ עֲלַהּ בְּמַעְרְבָא אִם כֵּן לִיבְנוֹ אַחַד (בְּ)טוּרָא
human_translation: the generation of the dispersion have no share in the World-to-Come. What did they perform? The school of Rabbi Sheila say We will build a tower and ascend to heaven, and we will strike it with axes so that its waters will flow. They laughed at in the West, If let them build on a mountain;
llm_translation: Generation of the Dispersion, they have no portion in the World to Come, etc. What is the labor? The house of Rabbi Sheila said: A tower was built and ascended to the sky, and struck it with axes so that its waters would gush forth. They waited for it in the west. If so, let us build one tower in Tur'a.

hebrew_text: (אֶלָּא) אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה בַּר אֶלְעָזָר נֶחְלְקוּ לְשָׁלֹשׁ כִּיתּוֹת אַחַת אוֹמֶרֶת נַעֲלֶה וְנֵשֵׁב שָׁם וְאַחַת אוֹמֶרֶת נַעֲלֶה וְנַעֲבוֹד עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה וְאַחַת אוֹמֶרֶת נַעֲלֶה וְנַעֲשֶׂה מִלְחָמָה זוֹ שֶׁאוֹמֶרֶת נַעֲלֶה וְנֵשֵׁב שָׁם  הֱפִיצָם ה' וְזוֹ שֶׁאוֹמֶרֶת נַעֲלֶה וְנַעֲשֶׂה מִלְחָמָה  נַעֲשׂוּ קוֹפִים וְרוּחוֹת וְשֵׁידִים וְלִילִין וְזוֹ שֶׁאוֹמֶרֶת נַעֲלֶה וְנַעֲבוֹד עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה  כִּי שָׁם בָּלַל ה' שְׂפַת כׇּל הָאָרֶץ
human_translation: Rather, Rabbi Yirmeya bar Elazar says: They divided into three factions; one said: Let us ascend and dwell there. And one said: Let us ascend and engage in idol worship. And one said: Let us ascend and wage war. that that said: Let us ascend and dwell there, God dispersed them. And that that said: Let us ascend and wage war, became apes, and spirits, and demons, and female demons. And that that said: Let us ascend and engage in idol wor-ship, “Because there the Lord confounded the language of all the earth”
llm_translation: Rather, Rabbi Yirmiyah bar Elazar said: They divided into three groups. One says, "Let us ascend and dwell there." Another says, "Let us ascend and serve foreign worship." And another says, "Let us ascend and engage in warfare." Regarding the group that says, "Let us ascend and dwell there," the Lord scattered them. And regarding the group that says, "Let us ascend and engage in warfare," they became apes, spirits, demons, and night demons. And regarding the group that says, "Let us ascend and serve foreign worship," for there the Lord confused the language of the whole earth.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא רַבִּי נָתָן אוֹמֵר כּוּלָּם לְשֵׁם עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה נִתְכַּוְּונוּ  כְּתִיב הָכָא נַעֲשָׂה לָנוּ שֵׁם וּכְתִיב הָתָם וְשֵׁם אֱלֹהִים אֲחֵרִים לֹא תַזְכִּירוּ מָה לְהַלָּן  עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה אַף כָּאן  עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Natan says: All of intended for the sake of idol worship. It is written here: “And let us make a name for us” and it is written there: “And make no mention of the name of the other gods” Just as there, is idol worship, so too here, is idol worship.
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Nathan says, all of them were intended for the sake of idol worship. It is written here, "We have made a name for ourselves," and it is written there, "And the names of other gods you shall not mention." Just as there it refers to idol worship, so too here it refers to idol worship.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִגְדָּל שְׁלִישׁ נִשְׂרַף שְׁלִישׁ נִבְלַע שְׁלִישׁ קַיָּים אָמַר רַב אֲוִיר מִגְדָּל מְשַׁכֵּחַ אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף בָּבֶל וּבוֹרְסִיף סִימָן רַע לַתּוֹרָה מַאי בּוֹרְסִיף אָמַר רַבִּי אַסִּי בּוֹר שָׁאפֵי
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: The third tower was burned, third was swallowed third remained Rav says: The atmosphere of the tower causes forgetfulness; Rav Yosef says: Babylonia and Bursif, are a bad omen for Torah, What Bursif? Rabbi Asi says: empty pit [ bor shafi ].
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: One-third of the tower burned, one-third was swallowed, and one-third remained standing. Rav Avir said: The tower causes forgetfulness. Rav Yosef said: Babylon and Borsif are a bad omen for the Torah. What is Borsif? Rabbi Assi said: A pit that swallows.

hebrew_text: אַנְשֵׁי סְדוֹם אֵין לָהֶם חֵלֶק לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא וְכוּ' תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן אַנְשֵׁי סְדוֹם אֵין לָהֶן חֵלֶק לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר 'וְאַנְשֵׁי סְדֹם רָעִים וְחַטָּאִים לַה' מְאֹד' 'רָעִים'  בָּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה 'וְחַטָּאִים'  לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא
human_translation: The people of Sodom have no share in the World-to-Come. The Sages taught: The people of Sodom have no share in the World-to-Come, as it is stated: “And the men of Sodom were wicked and sinners before the Lord exceedingly” “Wicked” in this world; “and sinners” for the World-to-Come.
llm_translation: Men of Sodom, they have no portion in the World to Come, etc. The Rabbis taught: Men of Sodom, they have no portion in the World to Come, as it is stated, "And the men of Sodom were wicked and sinful before the Lord exceedingly" (Genesis 13:13) - "wicked" in this world, "and sinful" in the World to Come.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה רָעִים בְּגוּפָן וְחַטָּאִים בְּמָמוֹנָם רָעִים בְּגוּפָן דִּכְתִיב וְאֵיךְ אֶעֱשֶׂה הָרָעָה הַגְּדֹלָה הַזֹּאת וְחָטָאתִי לֵאלֹהִים וְחַטָּאִים בְּמָמוֹנָם דִּכְתִיב וְהָיָה בְךָ חֵטְא לַה' זוֹ בִּרְכַּת הַשֵּׁם מְאֹד שֶׁמִּתְכַּוְּונִים וְחוֹטְאִים
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says: “Wicked” with their bodies; “and sinners” with their money. “Wicked” with their bodies, as it is written “And how can I do this great wickedness, and sin against God” “And sinners” with their money, as it is written: for it shall be reckoned to you as a sin” “Before the Lord”; this blessing, God. “Exceedingly” that they had intent and sinned
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said: The wicked are in their own bodies, and sinners are in their wealth. The wicked are in their own bodies, as it is written, "And how can I do this great evil and sin against God?" (Genesis 39:9) And sinners are in their wealth, as it is written, "And there shall be a sin in you to the Lord." This refers to the blessing of the Name, for they intend well but sin.

hebrew_text: בְּמַתְנִיתָא תָּנָא 'רָעִים' בְּמָמוֹנָם 'וְחַטָּאִים' בְּגוּפָן 'רָעִים' בְּמָמוֹנָם דִּכְתִיב 'וְרָעָה עֵינֶךָ בְּאָחִיךָ הָאֶבְיוֹן' 'וְחַטָּאִים' בְּגוּפָן דִּכְתִיב 'וְחָטָאתִי לֵאלֹהִים' 'לַה'' זוֹ בִּרְכַּת הַשֵּׁם 'מְאֹד' זוֹ שְׁפִיכוּת דָּמִים שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר 'וְגַם דָּם נָקִי שָׁפַךְ מְנַשֶּׁה בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם הַרְבֵּה מְאֹד' [וְגוֹ']
human_translation: It was taught in a baraita : “Wicked” with their money; “and sinners” with their bodies. “Wicked” with their money, as it is written: “And your eye is wicked against your poor brother “And sinners” with their bodies, as it is written “And sin against God” “Before the Lord”; this blessing, God. “Exceedingly [ meod ]” bloodshed, as it is stated: “Moreover Manasseh shed very [ meod ] much blood”
llm_translation: In the Mishnah it was taught: 'Evil' in their wealth, 'and sinners' in their bodies. 'Evil' in their wealth, as it is written, "And evil be your eye towards your destitute brother." 'And sinners' in their bodies, as it is written, "And I have sinned against God." 'To the Lord' - this is the blessing of the Name. 'Greatly' - this is shedding of blood, as it is said, "And also innocent blood did Manasseh shed very much in Jerusalem." etc.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן אַנְשֵׁי סְדוֹם לֹא נִתְגָּאוּ אֶלָּא בִּשְׁבִיל טוֹבָה שֶׁהִשְׁפִּיעַ לָהֶם הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא וּמָה כְּתִיב בָּהֶם 'אֶרֶץ מִמֶּנָּה יֵצֵא לָחֶם וְתַחְתֶּיהָ נֶהְפַּךְ כְּמוֹ אֵשׁ מְקוֹם סַפִּיר אֲבָנֶיהָ וְעַפְרֹת זָהָב לוֹ נָתִיב לֹא יְדָעוֹ עָיִט וְלֹא שְׁזָפַתּוּ עֵין אַיָּה לֹא הִדְרִיכוּהוּ בְנֵי שָׁחַץ לֹא עָדָה עָלָיו שָׁחַל'
human_translation: The Sages taught: The people of Sodom became haughty due only to the goodness that the Holy One, Blessed be He, bestowed upon them. And what is written concerning them, “As for the earth, out of it comes bread, and underneath it is turned up as it were by fire. Its stones are the place of sapphires, and it has dust of gold. That path no bird of prey knows, neither has the falcon’s eye seen it. The proud beasts have not trodden it, nor has the lion passed thereby”
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: The people of Sodom were not arrogant except for the good that the Holy One, blessed be He, bestowed upon them. And what is written about them? "From its produce bread came forth, and it was turned over beneath it like the burning of a fire; the place of its stones was of sapphire, and it had dust of gold. There was no path known to it, nor did the falcon's eye see it. The proud beasts did not tread it, nor did the lion pass over it."

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ 'וְכִי מֵאַחַר שֶׁאֶרֶץ מִמֶּנָּה יֵצֵא לָחֶם וְעַפְרֹת זָהָב לוֹ לָמָּה לָנוּ עוֹבְרֵי דְרָכִים שֶׁאֵין בָּאִים אֵלֵינוּ אֶלָּא לְחַסְּרֵינוּ [מִמָּמוֹנֵנוּ] בּוֹאוּ וּנְשַׁכַּח תּוֹרַת רֶגֶל מֵאַרְצֵנוּ' שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר 'פָּרַץ נַחַל מֵעִם גָּר הַנִּשְׁכָּחִים מִנִּי רָגֶל דַּלּוּ מֵאֱנוֹשׁ נָעוּ'
human_translation: said: Since a land from which bread comes and has the dust of gold, Why do we need travelers, as they come only to divest us of our property? Come, let us cause the treatment of travelers to be forgotten from our land, as it is stated: “He breaks open a watercourse in a place far from inhabitants, forgotten by pedestrians, they are dried up, they have moved away from men”
llm_translation: They said, "And when the land from which bread and dust of gold comes forth for him, why do we need passersby who come to us only to impoverish us of our wealth? Come, let us forget the teaching of the foot from our land," as it is said, "A stream breaks forth from the sojourner, those forgotten by the foot, they are driven away from mankind."

hebrew_text: דָּרֵשׁ רָבָא מַאי דִּכְתִיב עַד אָנָה תְּהוֹתְתוּ עַל אִישׁ תְּרׇצְּחוּ כֻלְּכֶם כְּקִיר נָטוּי גָּדֵר הַדְּחוּיָה  מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהָיוּ נוֹתְנִין עֵינֵיהֶן בְּבַעֲלֵי מָמוֹן וּמוֹשִׁיבִין אוֹתוֹ אֵצֶל קִיר נָטוּי וְדוֹחִין אוֹתוֹ עָלָיו וּבָאִים וְנוֹטְלִין אֶת מָמוֹנוֹ
human_translation: Rava taught: What which is written: “How long will you seek to overwhelm a man? You will all be murdered like a leaning wall or a tottering fence” teaches that set their sights on property owners. and place him alongside an inclined, wall and push it upon him and they come and take his property.
llm_translation: Rava sought: What is the meaning of what is written, "How long will you plot murder, all of you, like a leaning wall, a tottering fence?" (Psalms 62:4) This teaches that they would set their eyes on wealthy individuals and place him next to a leaning wall, and push him against it, and then come and take his money.

hebrew_text: דָּרֵשׁ רָבָא מַאי דִּכְתִיב חָתַר בַּחֹשֶׁךְ בָּתִּים יוֹמָם חִתְּמוּ לָמוֹ לֹא יָדְעוּ אוֹר  מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהָיוּ נוֹתְנִים עֵינֵיהֶם בְּבַעֲלֵי מָמוֹן וּמַפְקִידִים אֶצְלוֹ אֲפַרְסְמוֹן וּמַנִּיחִים אוֹתוֹ בְּבֵית גִּנְזֵיהֶם לָעֶרֶב בָּאִים וּמְרִיחִין אוֹתוֹ כְּכֶלֶב שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר יָשׁוּבוּ לָעֶרֶב יֶהֱמוּ כַכָּלֶב וִיסוֹבְבוּ עִיר וּבָאִים וְחוֹתְרִים שָׁם וְנוֹטְלִין אוֹתוֹ מָמוֹן
human_translation: Rava taught: What which is written: “In the dark they dig through houses; by day they shut themselves up; they know not the light” teaches that they would set their sights on property owners. and give him balsam, and place it in his treasury. In the evening, would come and sniff it like a dog as it is stated: “They return at evening; they howl like a dog, and go round about the city” And they would come and dig there, and they would take that property.
llm_translation: Rava sought to explain: What is the meaning of what is written, "They dig in the darkness, in houses they seal themselves up; they know not the light"? This teaches that they used to place their eyes on wealthy individuals, appoint a watchman over him, and deposit him in their treasure house until evening. They would come and smell him like a dog, as it is said, "They return at evening, they howl like a dog, and go around the city. They wander up and down for food."

hebrew_text: [יָלִינוּ] מִבְּלִי לְבוּשׁ וְאֵין כְּסוּת בַּקָּרָה חֲמוֹר יְתוֹמִים יִנְהָגוּ יַחְבְּלוּ שׁוֹר אַלְמָנָה גְּבֻלוֹת יַשִּׂיגוּ עֵדֶר גָּזְלוּ וַיִּרְעוּ וְהוּא לִקְבָרוֹת יוּבָל וְעַל גָּדִישׁ יִשְׁקוֹד
human_translation: “They lie at night naked without clothing, and they have no covering in the cold” “They drive away the donkey of the fatherless; they take the widow’s ox as a pledge” “They trespass; they violently steal flocks and graze them” “For he is brought to the grave, and watch is kept over his tomb”
llm_translation: They spend the night without clothing, and there is no covering in the cold; the donkeys of orphans are driven, they seize the ox of a widow, they push boundaries, they steal a flock, and they pasture it; and he is led away to the graves, and upon the heap they trample.

hebrew_text: דָּרֵשׁ רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּצִיפּוֹרִי אִחַתְרַין הָהִיא לֵילְיָא תְּלָת מְאָה מַחְתְּרָתָא בְּצִיפּוֹרִי אֲתוֹ וְקָא מְצַעֲרִי לֵיהּ אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ יְהַבְיתְּ אוֹרְחֵיהּ לְגַנָּבֵי אֲמַר לְהוּ מִי הֲוָה יָדַעְנָא דְּאַתּוּ גַּנָּבֵי כִּי קָא נָח נַפְשֵׁיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי שָׁפְעִי מַרְזְבֵי דְצִיפּוֹרִי דְּמָא
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei taught in Tzippori That night three hundred tunnels were excavated in Tzippori came and harassed him; they said to him: You have given a way for thieves said to them: Did I know that thieves would come When Rabbi Yosei died, the gutters of Tzippori overflowed blood
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei sought in Tzipori, one hundred and thirteen lit. one hundred and two barrels of wine in Tzipori. He came and found it diminished. They said to him, "You have provided a path for thieves." He said to them, "Who could have known that thieves would come when his soul was at rest, for Rabbi Yosei was a wealthy man in Tzipori, the blood of the vineyards of Tzipori."

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי דְּאִית לֵיהּ חַד תּוֹרָא מַרְעֵי חַד יוֹמָא דְּלֵית לֵיהּ  לִירְעֵי תְּרֵי יוֹמֵי הָהוּא יַתְמָא בַּר אַרְמַלְתָּא [יְ]הַבוּ לֵיהּ תּוֹרֵי לְמִרְעֵיה אֲזַל שַׁקְלִינְהוּ וְקַטְלִינְהוּ אֲמַר לְהוּ
human_translation: would say: who has one ox shall herd for one day. who does not have shall herd for two days. They gave oxen to a certain orphan, son of a widow, to herd. He went took them and killed them. said
llm_translation: They said, there was one ox that grazed for one day and did not have enough to graze for two days. That day, Yatma bar Armalta gave him two oxen to graze. He went, took them, and killed them. He said to them:

hebrew_text: דְּאִית לֵיהּ תּוֹרָא  נִשְׁקוֹל חַד מַשְׁכָּא דְּלֵית לֵיהּ תּוֹרָא  נִשְׁקוֹל תְּרֵי מַשְׁכֵּי אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ מַאי הַאי אֲמַר לְהוּ סוֹף דִּינָא כִּתְחִילַּת דִּינָא מָה תְּחִילַּת דִּינָא דְּאִית לֵיהּ תּוֹרָא מַרְעֵי חַד יוֹמָא דְּלֵית לֵיהּ תּוֹרֵי  מַרְעֵי תְּרֵי יוֹמֵי אַף סוֹף דִּינָא דְּאִית לֵיהּ חַד תּוֹרָא  לִשְׁקוֹל חַד דְּלֵית לֵיהּ תּוֹרָא  לִשְׁקוֹל תְּרֵי
human_translation: Let who has one ox take one hide let who does not have an ox take two hides. said to What this? said to them: The ultimate rule is parallel to the initial rule; just as the initial rule who has one ox shall herd for one day does not have oxen shall herd for two days, so too, the ultimate rule Let who has one ox take one let who does not have ox take two
llm_translation: If one has a Torah scroll, he should take one parchment that does not have a Torah scroll; if one does not have a Torah scroll, he should take two parchments. They said to him: What is this? He said to them: The end of the judgment is like the beginning of the judgment. Just as the beginning of the judgment, if one has one meal, he should take one parchment; if one does not have two meals, he should take two parchments.

hebrew_text: דְּעָבַר בְּמַבָּרָא נִיתֵּיב חַד זוּזָא דְּלָא עָבַר בְּמַבָּרָא  נִיתֵּיב תְּרֵי דַּהֲוָה לֵיהּ (תּוֹרָא) [דָּרָא] דְּלִבְנֵי אָתֵי כֹּל חַד וְחַד שָׁקֵיל חֲדָא אֲמַר לֵיהּ אֲנָא חֲדָא דִּשְׁקַלִי דַּהֲוָה שָׁדֵי תּוּמֵי אוֹ שַׁמְכֵי אֲתוֹ כֹּל חַד וְחַד שָׁקֵיל חֲדָא אֲמַר לֵיהּ אֲנָא חֲדָא דִּשְׁקַלִי
human_translation: Let who crosses on a ferry give one dinar let who does not cross on a ferry, give two who had a row of bricks, each and every one would take one say to him: I am taking one, who would cast garlic or onions each and every would take one say to him: I took one
llm_translation: In the past, in the west, one coin was given. If one did not pass in the west, two coins were given to him. He said to him, "I am the one who took one, for he was either blind or deaf." Each one took one coin. He said to him, "I am the one who took one."

hebrew_text: אַרְבַּע דַּיָּינֵי הָיוּ בִּסְדוֹם שַׁקְרַאי וְשַׁקְרוֹרַאי זַיְיפַי וּמַצְלֵי דִּינָא דְּמָחֵי לֵיהּ לְאִיתְּתָא דְּחַבְרֵיהּ וּמַפְּלָא (לֵיהּ) אָמְרִי לֵיהּ יַהֲבַהּ נִיהֲלֵיהּ דְּנִיעַבְּרַהּ נִיהֲלָיךְ דְּפָסֵיק לֵיהּ לְאוּדְנָא דַּחֲמָרָא דְּחַבְרֵיהּ אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ הֲבַהּ נִיהֲלֵיהּ עַד דְּקָדְחָא דְּפָדַע לֵיהּ לְחַבְרֵיהּ אָמְרִי לֵיהּ הַב לֵיהּ אַגְרָא דִּשְׁקַל לָךְ דְּמָא
human_translation: There were four judges in Sodom Shakrai, and Shakrurai, Zayfai, and Matzlei Dina, one who strikes the wife of another and causes her to miscarry, they would say to Give to one so that she will be impregnated for you who severed the ear of another’s donkey, they would say to Give until grows who wounds another, they would say Give a fee, as he let your blood.
llm_translation: Four judges were in Sodom, Shakrai, Shakrorai, Zaifai, and Matzlei Dinah. If someone killed his fellow's wife, they would say to him, "Give her to be judged, so that she may be passed over to you." If he refused to give her, they would say to him, "Give her until the jug of wine of your friend bursts." They would say to him, "Give him the reward that he took from you."

hebrew_text: דְּעָבַר בְּמַבָּרָא  יְהֵיב אַרְבְּעָה זוּזֵי דְּעָבַר בְּמַיָּא יָהֵיב תְּמָנְיָ[א] זוּזֵי זִימְנָא חֲדָא אֲתָא הָהוּא כּוֹבֵס אִיקְּלַע לְהָתָם אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ הַב אַרְבְּעָ[ה] זוּזֵי אָמַר לְהוּ אֲנָא בְּמַיָּא עֲבַרִי אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ אִם כֵּן הַב תְּמָנְיָא דַּעֲבַרְתְּ בְּמַיָּא לָא יְהַב פַּדְיוּהּ אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּדַיָּינָא אֲמַר לֵיהּ הַב לֵיהּ אַגְרָא דִּשְׁקַל לָךְ דְּמָא וּתְמָנְיָא זוּזֵי דַּעֲבַרְתְּ בְּמַיָּא
human_translation: who crossed on a ferry gives four dinars, who crossed in the water gives eight dinars. One time a certain launderer came arrived there. said to him: Give four dinars He said to them: I crossed in the water. They said to him: If so, give eight as you crossed in the water. He did not give wounded him. He came before the judge said to him: Give a fee, as he let your blood, and eight dinars, as you crossed in the water.
llm_translation: Passed in a ferry, he gave four zuzim; passed in a boat, he gave eight zuzim. One time, a launderer came there, they said to him, "Give four zuzim." He said to them, "I passed in a boat." They said to him, "If so, give eight zuzim, since you passed in a boat." He did not give the redemption. He came before the judge. The judge said to him, "Give him the wage that you took, blood and eight zuzim that you passed in a boat."

hebrew_text: אֱלִיעֶזֶר עֶבֶד אַבְרָהָם אִיתְרְמִי הָתָם פַּדְיוּהּי אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דַּיָּינָא אֲמַר לֵיהּ הַב לֵיהּ אַגְרָא דִּשְׁקַל לָךְ דְּמָא שְׁקַל גְּלָלָא פַּדְיֵוהּ אִיהוּ לְדַיָּינָא אֲמַר מַאי הַאי אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַגְרָא דִּנְפַק לִי מִינָּךְ הַב נִיהֲלֵיהּ לְהַאי וְזוּזֵי דִּידִי כִּדְקָיְימִי קָיְימִי
human_translation: Eliezer, servant of Abraham, happened there, they wounded him. He came before the judge said to him: Give a fee, as he let your blood. He took a stone he wounded the judge. said: What this? said to him: The fee that is paid to me by you, give it to that and my money will remain where it remains.
llm_translation: Eliezer, servant of Abraham, from Ithrami, there, his redemption, he came before the judge. He said to him, "Give him the reward that you took, for he redeemed it." He, to the judge, said, "What is this?" He said to him, "The reward that I received from you, give it to him, and my expenses, as they are, they are."

hebrew_text: הָוְיָא לְהוּ פּוּרְיְיתָא דַּהֲווֹ מַגְנִי עֲלַהּ אוֹרְחִין כִּי מַאֲרֵיךְ  גָּיְיזִי לֵיהּ כִּי גוּץ  מָתְחִין לֵיהּ אֱלִיעֶזֶר עֶבֶד אַבְרָהָם אִקְּלַע לְהָתָם אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ קוּם גְּנִי אַפּוּרְיָא אֲמַר לְהוֹן נִדְרָא נְדַרִי מִן יוֹמָא דְּמִיתַת אִמָּא לָא גָּנֵינָא אַפּוּרְיָא
human_translation: They had beds on which they would lay their guests; when was longer they cut him, when was shorter they would stretch him. Eliezer, servant of Abraham, happened there. They said to him: Come lie on the bed. He said to them: I took a vow since the day my mother died I do not lie on a bed.
llm_translation: Be to him a Purse of those who would shield him on the road, for he prolongs his strides, for he has stumbled. Matḥin to him Eliezer, servant of Abraham, he happened to be there, they said to him: "Arise, shield the Purse." He said to them: "My vow, my vow from the day my mother died, I have not shielded the Purse."

hebrew_text: כִּי הֲוָה מִתְרְמֵי לְהוּ עַנְיָא יְהַבוּ לֵיהּ כֹּל חַד וְחַד דִּינָרָא וּכְתִיב שְׁמֵיהּ עֲלֵיהּ וְרִיפְתָּא לָא הֲווֹ מַמְטֵי לֵיהּ כִּי הֲוָה מָיֵת אָתֵי כֹּל חַד וְחַד שָׁקֵיל דִּידֵיהּ
human_translation: When a poor person would happen to each and every would give him a dinar, and the name of was written on And they would not give him bread, When he would die, each and every person would come and take his
llm_translation: When they would bring him poor people's gifts, they would each give him a dinar, and it is written his name upon it, and they would not give him a loaf of bread. When he died, each one came and took back his gift.

hebrew_text: [אַתְנוֹ] בֵּינַיְיהוּ כֹּל מַאן דְּמַזְמֵין גַּבְרָא לְבֵי הִילּוּלָא לְשַׁלַּח גְּלִימָא הֲוִי הַאי הִילּוּלָא אִקְּלַע אֱלִיעֶזֶר לְהָתָם וְלָא יְהַבוּ לֵיהּ נַהֲמָא כִּי בָּעֵי לְמִסְעַד אֲתָא אֱלִיעֶזֶר וִיתֵיב לְסֵיפָא דְּכוּלְּהוּ אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ מַאן אַזְמְנָךְ לְהָכָא אֲמַר לֵיהּ לְהָהוּא [דְּיָתֵיב] אַתְּה זַמֵּנְתַּן [אֲמַר דִילְמָא שָׁמְעִי בִּי דַּאֲנָא אַזְמֵינְתֵּיהּ וּמְשַׁלְּחִי לֵיהּ מָאנֵיהּ דְּהַאי גַּבְרָא] שְׁקַל גְּלִימֵיהּ הָהוּא דְּיָתֵיב גַּבֵּיהּ וּרְהַט לְבָרָא וְכֵן עֲבַד לְכוּלְּהוּ עַד דְּנָפְקִי כּוּלְּהוּ וְאַכְלַאּ אִיהוּ לִסְעוּדְתָּא
human_translation: This stipulated among themselves: Whoever invites a man to a wedding, his cloak will be removed. There was this wedding, Eliezer, arrived there and they did not give him bread. When he sought to dine, Eliezer came and sat at the end, everyone. They said to him: Who invited you to here? He said to the one sitting You invited me. said Perhaps they will hear that I invited him and they will remove the garment of that man, The one who sat next to him took his cloak and ran outside. And likewise, did for all of them until they all left, and he ate the meal.
llm_translation: You between them, all who plot against a man to send him a robe, if this robe reaches the place of desecration, Eleazar will come there and they will not give him comfort, for he wants to dine. Eleazar comes and sits at the end of all. They said to him, "Who has plotted against you to come here?" He said to them, "To that one who is sitting, you have plotted." He said, "Perhaps he heard me that I plotted against him and sent him the robe of this man." He took off his robe, the one who was sitting opposite him, and threw it to the man, and he did the same to all of them until they all left, and he himself went to dine.

hebrew_text: הַוְיָא הָהִיא רָבִיתָא דַּהֲוָת קָא מַפְּקָא רִיפְתָּא לְעַנְיָא בְּחַצְבָּא אִיגַּלַּאי מִלְּתָא שַׁפְיוּהָ דּוּבְשָׁא וְאוֹקְמוּהָ עַל אִיגַּר שׁוּרָא אֲתֹא זִיבּוּרֵי וְאַכְלוּהָ וְהַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב וַיֹּאמֶר ה' זַעֲקַת סְדֹם וַעֲמֹרָה כִּי רָבָּה וְאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב עַל עִיסְקֵי רִיבָה
human_translation: There was a young woman who would take bread out to the poor people in a pitcher The matter was revealed, they smeared her with honey and positioned her on the wall the hornets came and consumed her. And that is which is written: “And the Lord said: Because the cry of Sodom and Gomorrah is great [ rabba ]” And Rav Yehuda says Rav says: matter of the young woman [ riva ]
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Be that certain woman who was distributing bread to the poor in a basket, a swarm of bees came, took the honeycomb, and placed it on a bull's horn. A flock of birds came, ate it, and this is what is written: 'And the Lord said, the outcry of Sodom and Gomorrah is great.' And Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav regarding matters of interest-bearing loans."

hebrew_text: מְרַגְּלִים אֵין לָהֶם חֵלֶק לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר 'וַיָּמֻתוּ הָאֲנָשִׁים מוֹצִאֵי דִבַּת הָאָרֶץ רָעָה בַּמַּגֵּפָה' 'וַיָּמֻתוּ'  בָּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה 'בַּמַּגֵּפָה'  לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא
human_translation: The spies have no share in the World-to-Come, as it is stated: “And those men who spread the evil report about the land died by plague “And…died” in this world, “by plague” for the World-to-Come.
llm_translation: Spies, they have no portion in the World to Come, as it is stated, "And the men who brought forth an evil report of the land died by the plague" (Numbers 14:37). "And they died" - in this world; "by the plague" - in the World to Come.

hebrew_text: עֲדַת קֹרַח אֵין לָהֶם חֵלֶק לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר 'וַתְּכַס עֲלֵיהֶם הָאָרֶץ'  בָּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה 'וַיֹּאבְדוּ מִתּוֹךְ הַקָּהָל'  לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר עֲלֵיהֶם אָמַר הַכָּתוּב 'ה' מֵמִית וּמְחַיֶּה מוֹרִיד שְׁאוֹל וַיָּעַל'
human_translation: the assembly of Korah have no share in the World-to-Come, as it is stated: “And the earth closed upon them” in this world, “And they perished from among the assembly” in the World-to-Come; the statement of Rabbi Akiva. Rabbi Eliezer says: About the verse states: “The Lord kills and makes alive; He lowers to the grave, and raises”
llm_translation: Assembly of Korah they have no portion in the World to Come as it is stated, "And the earth covered them" in this world "and they perished from among the congregation" in the World to Come. The words of Rabbi Akiva, Rabbi Eliezer say about them, the Scripture says, "The Lord kills and brings to life; He brings down to Sheol and raises up."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן עֲדַת קֹרַח אֵין לָהֶם חֵלֶק לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר 'וַתְּכַס עֲלֵיהֶם הָאָרֶץ'  בָּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה 'וַיֹּאבְדוּ מִתּוֹךְ הַקָּהָל'  לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בְּתִירָא אוֹמֵר הֲרֵי הֵן כַּאֲבֵידָה הַמִּתְבַּקֶּשֶׁת שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר 'תָּעִיתִי כְּשֶׂה אֹבֵד בַּקֵּשׁ עַבְדֶּךָ כִּי מִצְוֹתֶיךָ לֹא שָׁכָחְתִּי'
human_translation: The Sages taught the assembly of Korah have no share in the World-to-Come, as it is stated: “And the earth closed upon them” in this world, “And they perished from among the assembly” in the World-to-Come; the statement of Rabbi Akiva. Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira says: they are like a lost item that is sought, as it is stated: “I have gone astray like a lost sheep; seek out your servant, for I do not forget your mitzvot”
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: The congregation of Korah has no portion in the World to Come, as it is stated, "And the earth covered them" - in this world, "and they perished from among the assembly" - in the World to Come. These are the words of Rabbi Akiva. Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira says: They are like a lost object that is sought after, as it is stated, "I have gone astray like a lost sheep; seek Your servant, for I have not forgotten Your commandments."

hebrew_text: וַיִּקַּח [קֹרַח] אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ שֶׁלָּקַח מִקָּח רַע לְעַצְמוֹ קֹרַח  שֶׁנַּעֲשָׂה קׇרְחָה בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל בֶּן יִצְהָר  בֵּן שֶׁהִרְתִּיחַ עָלָיו אֶת כָּל הָעוֹלָם כַּצׇּהֳרַיִם בֶּן קְהָת  בֵּן שֶׁהִקְהָה שִׁינֵּי מוֹלִידָיו בֶּן לֵוִי  בֵּן שֶׁנַּעֲשָׂה לְוָיָה בְּגֵיהִנָּם
human_translation: “And Korah, took [ vayikkaḥ ]” Reish Lakish says: He purchased [ lakaḥ ] a bad acquisition for himself, “Korah” that a void [ korḥa ] was created in Israel. “Son of Izhar,” a son who incited the wrath of the entire world upon him like the afternoon [ tzohorayim ]. “Son of Kohath,” a son who blunted [ hik’ha ] the teeth of his parents, “Son of Levi,” a son who became an escort [ levaya ] in Gehenna.
llm_translation: And he took Korah, said Reish Lakish, that he took a bad acquisition for himself, Korah, who became bald in Israel, son of Izhar, son of Kohath, son of Levi, who became a Levite in Gehinnom.

hebrew_text: וְלִיחְשׁוֹב נָמֵי בֶּן יַעֲקֹב בֵּן שֶׁעָקַב עַצְמוֹ לְגֵיהִנָּם אָמַר רַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר רַב יִצְחָק יַעֲקֹב בִּיקֵּשׁ רַחֲמִים עַל עַצְמוֹ שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר בְּסֹדָם אַל תָּבֹא נַפְשִׁי בִּקְהָלָם אַל תֵּחַד כְּבֹדִי בְּסֹדָם אַל תָּבֹא נַפְשִׁי  אֵלּוּ מְרַגְּלִים בִּקְהָלָם אַל תֵּחַד כְּבֹדִי  זֶה עֲדַת קֹרַח
human_translation: But let also include: Son of Jacob [ Ya’akov ], A son who contorted [ she’akav ] himself Gehenna? Rav Shmuel bar Rav Yitzḥak says: Jacob prayed for mercy for himself as it is stated: “Let my soul not come into their council; to their assembly let my honor not be united” “Let my soul not come into their council”; these are spies. “To their assembly let my honor not be united”; this the assembly of Korah.
llm_translation: And Yichshov named son of Yaakov son of She'akav his bone to Gehinnam said Rav Shmuel bar Rav Yitzchak Yaakov sought mercy on his bone as it is said in Sodom "Let not my soul enter their council, let not my honor be united in their assembly" "Let not my soul enter" these are those who spy in their council "let not my honor be united" this is the congregation of Korach.

hebrew_text: דָּתָן שֶׁעָבַר עַל דָּת אֵל אֲבִירָם  שֶׁאִיבֵּר עַצְמוֹ מֵעֲשׂוֹת תְּשׁוּבָה וְאוֹן  שֶׁיָּשַׁב בַּאֲנִינוּת פֶּלֶת  שֶׁנַּעֲשׂוּ לוֹ פְּלָאוֹת בֶּן רְאוּבֵן  בֵּן שֶׁרָאָה וְהֵבִין
human_translation: “Dathan” who violated the precepts [ dat ] of God. “Abiram” who braced [ iber ] himself from repenting. “And On” who sat in acute mourning [ aninut ] “Peleth” for whom wonders [ pelaot ] were performed. Son of Reuben [ Reuven ], a son who saw and understood [ ra’a vehevin ]
llm_translation: Dathan who transgressed the decree of El Aviram who hardened himself from doing repentance and the strength that dwelt in the stubbornness of Pelet's son Ben Reuven, son who saw and understood.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אוֹן בֶּן פֶּלֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ הִצִּילַתּוּ אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ מַאי נָפְקָא לָךְ מִינַּהּ אִי מָר רַבָּה אַנְתְּ תַּלְמִידָא וְאִי מָר רַבָּה אַנְתְּ תַּלְמִידָא אֲמַר לַהּ מַאי אֶעֱבֵיד הֲוַאי בְּעֵצָה וְאִשְׁתְּבַעִי לִי בַּהֲדַיְיהוּ אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ יָדַעְנָא דְּכוּלַּהּ כְּנִישְׁתָּא קַדִּישְׁתָּא נִינְהוּ דִּכְתִיב 'כִּי כׇל הָעֵדָה כֻּלָּם קְדֹשִׁים' אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ תּוּב דַּאֲנָא מַצֵּילְנָא לָךְ אַשְׁקִיתֵיהּ חַמְרָא וְאַרְוִיתֵיהּ וְאַגְנִיתֵיהּ גַּוַּאי (אוֹתְבַהּ) [וִיתִבָא] עַל בָּבָא
human_translation: Rav says: On, son of Peleth, his wife saved him. She said to him: What is the difference to you? If Master, the great you the student. And if Master, the great you the student. said to her: What shall I do? I was who took counsel and I took an oath with them She said to him: I know that the entire assembly is holy, as it is written: “For all the assembly is holy” She said to him: Sit, for I will save you. She gave him wine to drink and caused him to become drunk and laid him inside She sat at the entrance
llm_translation: Rav On ben Pelet said: His wife saved him. She said to him, "What benefit do you derive from her? If you are a master, you should learn Torah, and if you are a disciple, you should engage in study." He said to her, "What shall I do?" She replied, "I know that they are all holy assemblies, as it is written, 'For all the congregation are holy.'" He said to her, "You have spoken well; I will reward you with wine, fine flour, and a golden vessel." And he went to his father-in-law's house.

hebrew_text: וּסְתַרְתֵּהּ לְמַזְּיַהּ כֹּל דַּאֲתָא חַזְיַהּ הֲדַר אַדְּהָכִי וְהָכִי אִבְּלַעוּ לְהוּ
human_translation: and exposed her hair Anyone who came saw her back. In the meantime was swallowed
llm_translation: And she hid him for three months, as it is stated: "And when she could no longer hide him, she took for him an ark of bulrushes" (Exodus 2:3).

hebrew_text: אִיתְּתֵיהּ דְּקֹרַח אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ חֲזִי מַאי קָעָבֵיד מֹשֶׁה אִיהוּ הֲוָה מַלְכָּא לַאֲחוּהּ שַׁוְּויֵהּ כָּהֲנָא רַבָּא לִבְנֵי אֲחוֹהִי שַׁוִּינְהוּ סְגָנֵי דְּכָהֲנָא אִי אָתְיָא תְּרוּמָה אָמַר 'תֶּיהְוֵי לְכָהֵן' אִי אָתוּ מַעֲשֵׂר דְּשָׁקְלִיתוּ אַתּוּן אָמַר 'הַבוּ חַד מֵעַשְׂרָה לְכָהֵן' וְעוֹד דְּגָיֵיז לֵיהּ לְמָזַיְיכוּ וּמִיטַּלַּל (לְכוּ) [בְּכוּ] כִּי כוּפְתָּא עֵינָא יְהַב בְּמָזַיְיכוּ אֲמַר לַהּ הָא אִיהוּ נָמֵי קָא עָבֵיד אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ כֵּיוָן דְּכוּלְּהוּ רְבוּתָא דִּידֵיהּ אָמַר אִיהוּ נָמֵי 'תָּמֹת נַפְשִׁי עִם פְּלִשְׁתִּים'
human_translation: Korah’s wife said to him: See what Moses is doing. He is the king, he appointed his brother High Priest, he appointed his brother’s sons deputy priests. If teruma comes, he says: Let it be for the priest; if tithe comes, which you take, he says: Give one tenth to the priest. And furthermore, he shears your hair and waves you as excrement he set sights on your hair said to her: But didn’t he also do so; She said to him: Since it is all for his own prominence, he also said “Let me die with the Philistines”
llm_translation: His wife, the wife of Korah, said to him, "See what Moses is doing. He is making himself king over the community, appointing his brother Aaron as High Priest. He has also appointed the sons of his brother as deputy priests. If you come with your contribution, he says, 'It shall belong to the priest.' If you bring your tithe in silver, they say, 'Give one-tenth to the priest.' And he also ridicules you, saying, 'Go and weep, for you have been duped.' When he gives you a share of the spoils, he says to you, 'Indeed, he is doing the same.' Since all of this is for his own benefit, she said to him, 'I would rather die with the Philistines.'"

hebrew_text: וְעוֹד דְּקָאָמַר לְכוּ עָבְדִיתוּ תְּכֵלְתָּא אִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ תְּכֵלְתָּא חֲשִׁיבָא [מִצְוָה]  אַפֵּיק גְּלִימֵי דִּתְכֵלְתָּא וְכַסִּינְהוּ לְכוּלְּהוּ מְתִיבְתָּךְ הַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב חׇכְמוֹת נָשִׁים בָּנְתָה בֵיתָהּ  זוֹ אִשְׁתּוֹ שֶׁל אוֹן בֶּן פֶּלֶת וְאִוֶּלֶת בְּיָדָהּ תֶּהֶרְסֶנָּה  זוֹ אִשְׁתּוֹ שֶׁל קֹרַח
human_translation: And furthermore, which he said to you, to prepare sky-blue dye If it enters your mind, sky-blue dye is considered a mitzva, take out robes of sky-blue dye, and dress all of your academy This is which is written: “The wisdom of women builds her house” this the wife of On, son of Peleth. “Folly plucks it down with her hands” this the wife of Korah.
llm_translation: And furthermore, as he said, "Go and make for yourselves tekhelet. If it is the case that your intention is for tekhelet to be considered a mitzvah, bring out the garments of tekhelet and cover them all." Your objection is answered: This is as it is written, "Wisdom has built her house, she has hewn out her seven pillars." This refers to the wife of On ben Pelet, and "she will destroy it with her own hands" refers to the wife of Korah.

hebrew_text: וַיָּקֻמוּ לִפְנֵי מֹשֶׁה וַאֲנָשִׁים מִבְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל חֲמִשִּׁים וּמָאתָיִם [נְשִׂיאֵי עֵדָה] מְיוּחָדִים שֶׁבָּעֵדָה קְרִיאֵי מוֹעֵד שֶׁהָיוּ יוֹדְעִים לְעַבֵּר שָׁנִים וְלִקְבּוֹעַ חֳדָשִׁים אַנְשֵׁי שֵׁם שֶׁהָיָה לָהֶם שֵׁם בְּכׇל הָעוֹלָם
human_translation: “And they arose before Moses, with men from the children of Israel, two hundred and fifty the distinctive people of the assembly. “The elect men of the assembly [ keri’ei moed ]” who knew to intercalate the years and establish the months “Men of renown [ shem ],” who had a reputation [ shem ] throughout the world.
llm_translation: And they arose before Moses, and men from the children of Israel, fifty and two hundred leaders of the congregation, distinguished, who were called for the congregation, knowledgeable in intercalating years and establishing months, men of renown, whose name was renowned throughout the world.

hebrew_text: וַיִּשְׁמַע מֹשֶׁה וַיִּפֹּל עַל פָּנָיו מָה שְׁמוּעָה שְׁמַע אָמַר רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן שֶׁחֲשָׁדוּהוּ מֵאֵשֶׁת אִישׁ שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וַיְקַנְאוּ לְמֹשֶׁה בַּמַּחֲנֶה אָמַר רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר יִצְחָק מְלַמֵּד שֶׁכׇּל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד קִנֵּא אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ מִמֹּשֶׁה שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וּמֹשֶׁה יִקַּח אֶת הָאֹהֶל וְנָטָה לוֹ מִחוּץ לַמַּחֲנֶה
human_translation: “And Moses heard and he fell on his face” What report did he hear Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani says Rabbi Yonatan says: that they suspected him with a married woman, as it is stated: “And they were jealous of Moses in the camp” Rabbi Shmuel bar Yitzḥak says: teaches that each and every warned his wife from Moses as it is stated: “And Moses would take the tent and pitch it outside the camp”
llm_translation: Moses heard and fell on his face. What did he hear? He heard, "Sh'mua Sh'ma" (Deuteronomy 6:4). Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said, Rabbi Yonatan said: They suspected him regarding another man's wife, as it is said, "And they were jealous for Moses in the camp" (Numbers 11:29).
