Rabbi Shmuel bar Yitzchak teaches that this teaches that each and every one was jealous of his wife for Moses, as it is said, "And Moses took the tent and pitched it outside the camp" (Exodus 33:7).

hebrew_text: וַיָּקׇם מֹשֶׁה וַיֵּלֶךְ אֶל דָּתָן וַאֲבִירָם אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ מִכָּאן שֶׁאֵין מַחְזִיקִין בְּמַחְלוֹקֶת דְּאָמַר רַב כׇּל הַמַּחְזִיק בְּמַחְלוֹקֶת עוֹבֵר בְּלָאו שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וְלֹא יִהְיֶה כְקֹרַח וְכַעֲדָתוֹ
human_translation: “And Moses arose and went to Dathan and Abiram” Reish Lakish says: From here that one may not perpetuate a dispute, as Rav says: Anyone who perpetuates a dispute violates a prohibition, as it is stated: “And he will not be like Korah and his assembly,
llm_translation: Moses arose and went to Dathan and Abiram. Reish Lakish said: From here we learn that one should not engage in disputes. For Rav said: Anyone who engages in disputes transgresses a negative commandment, as it is stated, "And there shall not be like Korah and his assembly."

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר רָאוּי לִיצְטָרֵעַ  כְּתִיב הָכָא בְּיַד מֹשֶׁה לוֹ וּכְתִיב הָתָם וַיֹּאמֶר ה' לוֹ עוֹד הָבֵא נָא יָדְךָ בְּחֵיקֶךָ
human_translation: Rav Ashi says: is fit to be afflicted with leprosy. It is written here: “By the hand of Moses to him,” and it is written there: “And the Lord said furthermore to him: Put now your hand into your bosom.
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: "Fit for contracting tzara'at." It is written here, "by the hand of Moses to him," and it is written there, "And Hashem said to him, 'Put your hand into your bosom.'"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי כׇּל הַחוֹלֵק עַל מַלְכוּת בֵּית דָּוִד רָאוּי לְהַכִּישׁוֹ נָחָשׁ  כְּתִיב הָכָא וַיִּזְבַּח אֲדֹנִיָּהוּ צֹאן וּבָקָר וּמְרִיא עִם אֶבֶן הַזֹּחֶלֶת וּכְתִיב הָתָם עִם חֲמַת זֹחֲלֵי עָפָר
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: anyone who disputes the reign of the house of David, it is fitting for a snake to bite him. it is written here: “And Adonijah slaughtered sheep and cattle and fatlings by the stone of Zoheleth” and it is written there: “With the poison of crawling things [ zoḥalei ] of the dust”
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei said: Anyone who disputes the kingship of the House of David is fitting to be silenced like a snake. It is written here, "And Adonijah sacrificed sheep, oxen, and fattened cattle by the Stone of Zoheleth," and it is written there, "By the brook that flows through the valley of the ants."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא כׇּל הַחוֹלֵק עַל רַבּוֹ  כְּחוֹלֵק עַל הַשְּׁכִינָה שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר בְּהַצֹּתָם עַל ה' אָמַר רַבִּי חָמָא בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא כָּל הָעוֹשֶׂה מְרִיבָה עִם רַבּוֹ כְּעוֹשֶׂה עִם שְׁכִינָה שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר הֵמָּה מֵי מְרִיבָה אֲשֶׁר רָבוּ בְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל אֶת ה'
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda says: Anyone who disagrees with his teacher is like one who disagrees with the Divine Presence, as it is stated “When they strove against the Lord” Rabbi Ḥama, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, says: Anyone who initiates a quarrel [ meriva ] with his teacher is like one who initiates a quarrel with the Divine Presence, as it is stated: “These are the waters of Meribah, where the children of Israel quarreled with the Lord”
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: Anyone who disputes with his master is considered as if he is disputing with the Divine Presence, as it is stated, "When they rebelled against the Lord" (Numbers 20:13). Rabbi Ḥama son of Rabbi Ḥanina said: Anyone who engages in strife with his master is considered as if he is engaging in strife with the Divine Presence, as it is stated, "These are the waters of Meribah, where the children of Israel quarreled with the Lord" (Numbers 20:13).

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בַּר פָּפָּא כׇּל הַמִּתְרַעֵם עַל רַבּוֹ כְּאִילּוּ מִתְרַעֵם עַל הַשְּׁכִינָה שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר לֹא עָלֵינוּ תְלֻנֹּתֵיכֶם כִּי אִם עַל ה' אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ כׇּל הַמְהַרְהֵר אַחַר רַבּוֹ  כְּאִילּוּ מְהַרְהֵר אַחַר שְׁכִינָה שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וַיְדַבֵּר הָעָם בֵּאלֹהִים וּבְמֹשֶׁה
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina bar Pappa says: Anyone who expresses resentment against his teacher it is as though he is expressing resentment against the Divine Presence, as it is stated: “Your murmurings are not against us, but against the Lord” Rabbi Abbahu says: Anyone who suspects his teacher it is as though he suspects the Divine Presence, as it is stated: “And the people spoke against God, and against Moses”
llm_translation: Rabbi Chanina bar Papa said: Anyone who rebels against his master, it is as though he rebels against the Divine Presence, as it is stated, "Your complaints are not against us, but against the Lord." Rabbi Avahu said: Anyone who harbors thoughts against his master, it is as though he harbors thoughts against the Divine Presence, as it is stated, "And the people spoke against God and against Moses."

hebrew_text: עֹשֶׁר שָׁמוּר לִבְעָלָיו לְרָעָתוֹ אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ זֶה עוֹשְׁרוֹ שֶׁל קֹרַח וְאֶת כׇּל הַיְקוּם אֲשֶׁר בְּרַגְלֵיהֶם אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר זֶה מָמוֹנוֹ שֶׁל אָדָם שֶׁמַּעֲמִידוֹ עַל רַגְלָיו וְאָמַר רַבִּי לֵוִי מַשּׂוֹי שְׁלֹשׁ מֵאוֹת פְּרָדוֹת לְבָנוֹת הָיוּ מַפְתְּחוֹת שֶׁל בֵּית גְּנָזָיו שֶׁל קֹרַח וְכוּלְּהוּ אַקְלִידֵי וְקִילְפֵי דְּגִילְדָּא
human_translation: “Wealth is kept for the owner to his detriment” Reish Lakish says: This the wealth of Korah, “And all the substance that was at their feet” Rabbi Elazar says: This a person’s property, which stands him on his feet. And Rabbi Levi says: The keys to Korah’s treasury were a burden three hundred white mules and all the keys [ aklidei ] and locks were of leather.
llm_translation: Wealth guarded for its owner to his detriment, Reish Lakish said: This is the wealth of Korach and all the world that is under their feet, Rabbi Elazar said: This is the money of a person that supports him on his feet, and Rabbi Levi said: Three hundred white mules were the keys to the treasuries of Korach's house, all of them were keys and locks of Gildada.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חָמָא בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא שָׁלֹשׁ מַטְמוֹנִיּוֹת הִטְמִין יוֹסֵף בְּמִצְרַיִם אַחַת נִתְגַּלְּתָה לְקֹרַח וְאַחַת נִתְגַּלְּתָה לְאַנְטוֹנִינוּס בֶּן אַסְוִירוּס וְאַחַת גְּנוּזָה לְצַדִּיקִים לֶעָתִיד לָבוֹא
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥama, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, says: Joseph concealed three buried treasures in Egypt one was revealed to Korah, and one was revealed to Antoninus, son of Asveirus, and one hidden for the righteous in the future,
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Ḥama son of Rabbi Ḥanina: Three treasures Joseph hid in Egypt: one was revealed to Korah, one was revealed to Antoninus son of Asviros, and one is hidden for the righteous in the future to come.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן קֹרַח לֹא מִן הַבְּלוּעִים וְלֹא מִן הַשְּׂרוּפִין לֹא מִן הַבְּלוּעִין דִּכְתִיב וְאֶת כׇּל הָאָדָם אֲשֶׁר לְקֹרַח וְלֹא קֹרַח וְלֹא מִן הַשְּׂרוּפִים דִּכְתִיב בַּאֲכֹל הָאֵשׁ אֵת חֲמִשִּׁים וּמָאתַיִם אִישׁ וְלֹא קֹרַח
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Korah was neither among the swallowed nor among the burned; neither among the swallowed, as it is written: and all the men who were with Korah” But not Korah Nor among the burned, as it is written: “When the fire consumed two hundred and fifty men” but not Korah.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yochanan said: Korach was not from the ones who were swallowed up, nor from the ones who were burned. Not from the ones who were swallowed up, as it is written, "and all the men who were for Korach." And not from the ones who were burned, as it is written, "in the fire consumed two hundred and fifty men." And not Korach.

hebrew_text: בְּמַתְנִיתָא תָּנָא קֹרַח מִן הַשְּׂרוּפִין וּמִן הַבְּלוּעִין מִן הַבְּלוּעִים דִּכְתִיב 'וַתִּבְלַע אֹתָם וְאֶת קֹרַח' מִן הַשְּׂרוּפִין  דִּכְתִיב 'וַתֵּצֵא אֵשׁ מִלִּפְנֵי ה' [וְאֵשׁ יָצְאָה מֵאֵת ה'] וַתֹּאכַל אֵת הַחֲמִשִּׁים וּמָאתַיִם אִישׁ' וְקֹרַח בַּהֲדַיְיהוּ
human_translation: was taught in a baraita : Korah was among the burned and among the swallowed. among the swallowed, as it is written: and swallowed them with Korah” among the burned, as it is written: “And fire came forth from the Lord, and devoured the two hundred and fifty men and Korah was with them.
llm_translation: In the Mishnah it was taught: Korah was taken from those who were swallowed by the earth and from those who were burned by fire. From those who were swallowed, as it is written, "and the earth opened its mouth and swallowed them and Korah" Numbers 16:32. From those who were burned, as it is written, "and fire came out from the Lord and consumed the two hundred and fifty men" Numbers 16:35, and Korah with them.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא מַאי דִּכְתִיב שֶׁמֶשׁ יָרֵחַ עָמַד זְבֻלָה לְאוֹר חִצֶּיךָ יְהַלֵּכוּ  מְלַמֵּד שֶׁעָלוּ שֶׁמֶשׁ וְיָרֵחַ לִזְבוּל אָמְרוּ לְפָנָיו רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם אִם אַתָּה עוֹשֶׂה דִּין לְבֶן עַמְרָם נֵצֵא וְאִם לָאו  לֹא נֵצֵא עַד שֶׁזָּרַק בָּהֶם חִצִּים אָמַר לָהֶן בִּכְבוֹדִי לֹא מְחִיתֶם בִּכְבוֹד בָּשָׂר וָדָם מְחִיתֶם וְהָאִידָּנָא לָא נָפְקִי עַד דְּמָחוּ לְהוּ
human_translation: Rava says: What which is written: “The sun and moon stand still in their habitation [ zevula ], at the light of Your arrows as they go” teaches that the sun and moon ascended to zevul , They said before Master of the Universe, if You perform justice for the son of Amram, we will emerge And if not, we will not emerge. until fired arrows at them said to them: You did not protest with regard to My honor, you protested for the honor of flesh and blood? And today, do not emerge until they are struck,
llm_translation: Rava said: What is the meaning of what is written, "The sun and the moon stood still in their habitation; at the light of Your arrows they go, at the shining of Your glittering spear"? (Habakkuk 3:11) This teaches that the sun and the moon ascended to the firmament and said before the Holy One, blessed be He: Master of the Universe, if You execute judgment for the son of Amram, we will go forth; but if not, we will not go forth until You shoot arrows at us. He said to them: With My honor, I did not destroy you with honor, but with honor of flesh and blood I destroyed you. And now we have not gone out until they have rubbed themselves.

hebrew_text: דָּרֵשׁ רָבָא מַאי דִּכְתִיב וְאִם בְּרִיאָה יִבְרָא ה' וּפָצְתָה הָאֲדָמָה אֶת פִּיהָ  אָמַר מֹשֶׁה לִפְנֵי הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא אִם בְּרִיאָה גֵּיהִנָּם  מוּטָב וְאִם לָאו  יִבְרָא ה' לְמַאי אִילֵימָא לְמִבְרְיַהּ מַמָּשׁ וְהָא אֵין כׇּל חָדָשׁ תַּחַת הַשָּׁמֶשׁ אֶלָּא לְקָרוֹבֵי פִּיתְחָא
human_translation: Rava taught: What which is written: “But if the Lord creates a new creation and the earth opens its mouth” Moses said before the Holy One, Blessed be He: If Gehenna is created, good, but if not, God should create For what If we say to actually create but isn’t “There is nothing new under the sun” Rather, to bring the opening close
llm_translation: Rava sought: What is the meaning of what is written, "If the Lord creates through creation, and the earth opens its mouth"? Moses said before the Holy One, blessed be He: If Gehenna is created through creation, it is better. And if not, why does the Lord create? To what can this be compared? To a newly baked loaf, and there is nothing new under the sun except for that which is near the opening.

hebrew_text: וּבְנֵי קֹרַח לֹא מֵתוּ תָּנָא מִשּׁוּם רַבֵּינוּ אָמְרוּ מָקוֹם נִתְבַּצֵּר לָהֶם בְּגֵיהִנָּם וְיָשְׁבוּ עָלָיו וְאָמְרוּ שִׁירָה אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה זִימְנָא חֲדָא הֲוָה קָאָזֵילְנָא בְּאוֹרְחָא אֲמַר לִי הַהוּא טַיָּיעָא תָּא וְאַחְוֵי לָךְ בְּלוּעֵי דְקֹרַח (אָזֵיל חֲזָא) [אֲזַלִי חֲזַאי] תְּרֵי בִּזְעֵי דַּהֲוָה קָא נָפֵק קִיטְרָא מִנַּיְיהוּ שְׁקַל גְּבָבָא דְעַמְרָא אַמְשְׁיֵיהּ מַיָּא וְאוֹתְבֵיהּ בְּרֵישׁ רוּמְחֵיהּ וְאַחְלְפֵיהּ הָתָם אִיחֲרַךְ אָמַר לִי אַצֵּית מָה שָׁמְעַתְּ וּשְׁמַעִית דַּהֲווֹ קָאָמְרִי הָכִי 'מֹשֶׁה וְתוֹרָתוֹ אֱמֶת וְהֵן בִּדְאַיָּם'
human_translation: “And the sons of Korah did not die” taught in the name of our teacher, said: A place was fortified for them in Gehenna and they sat upon it and recited songs Rabba bar bar Ḥana said: One time I was walking on the path, a certain Arab said to me: Come and I will show you those of Korah swallowed. I went I saw two fissures from which smoke was emerging. took a woolen fleece dampened it with water and placed it on the tip of his spear and passed there. was singed, He said to me: Listen; what do you hear? And I heard that this they were saying: Moses and his Torah are truth, and they, are liars.
llm_translation: Sons of Korah did not die. It was taught in the name of our Rabbi: They found a place in Gehenna, sat upon it, and sang. Rabbah bar bar Ḥana said: Once I was walking on the road, and that old man met me and said to me, "Come, I will show you where Korah and his company are." I went and saw two cracks of smoke coming out. He took a clod of earth, soaked it in water, placed it on his head, and said to me, "If this clod remains dry, you will know that they accept my words." He placed it on his head, and it did not become wet. He said to me, "You have heard and understood that they say thus: 'Moses and his Torah are true, and we are liars.'"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ כֹּל תְּלָתִין יוֹמִין מְהַדְּרָא לְהוּ גֵּיהִנָּם כְּבָשָׂר בְּתוֹךְ קַלַּחַת וְאָמְרִי הָכִי 'מֹשֶׁה וְתוֹרָתוֹ אֱמֶת וְהֵן בַּדָּאִים'
human_translation: said to him: Every thirty days Gehenna returns them like meat in a cauldron, and they say this: Moses and his Torah are truth, and they are liars.
llm_translation: He said to him, "All thirty days they turn over in Gehinnom like meat in a pot." And they say thus, "Moses and his Torah are true, and they are reliable."

hebrew_text: דּוֹר הַמִּדְבָּר אֵין לָהֶם חֵלֶק לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא וְכוּ' תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן דּוֹר הַמִּדְבָּר אֵין לָהֶם חֵלֶק לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר 'בַּמִּדְבָּר הַזֶּה יִתַּמּוּ וְשָׁם יָמֻתוּ' 'יִתְמוּ'  בָּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה 'וְשָׁם יַמָּתוֹ'  בָּעוֹלָם הַבָּא וְאָמַר 'אֲשֶׁר נִשְׁבַּעְתִּי בְאַפִּי אִם יְבֹאוּן אֶל מְנוּחָתִי' דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא
human_translation: the generation of the wilderness have no share in the World-to-Come. The Sages taught: the generation of the wilderness have no share in the World-to-Come, as it is stated: “In this wilderness they shall be consumed, and there they shall die” “They shall be consumed” in this world; “and there they shall die” for the World-to-Come. And states “Wherefore I took an oath in My anger that they should not enter into My rest” the statement of Rabbi Akiva.
llm_translation: The generation of the desert, they have no portion in the World to Come, as it is taught: The Sages taught: The generation of the desert, they have no portion in the World to Come, as it says, "In this wilderness they shall be consumed, and there they shall die" - "they shall be consumed" in this world, "and there they shall die" in the World to Come. And it says, "As I swore in My wrath, if they shall enter into My rest" - these are the words of Rabbi Akiva.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר הֵן בָּאִין לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר 'אִסְפוּ לִי חֲסִידָי כֹּרְתֵי בְרִיתִי עֲלֵי זָבַח'  אֶלָּא מָה אֲנִי מְקַיֵּים 'אֲשֶׁר נִשְׁבַּעְתִּי בְאַפִּי' בְּאַפִּי נִשְׁבַּעְתִּי וְחוֹזְרַנִי בִּי
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: They come to the World-to-Come, as it is stated: “Gather My pious together to Me, those that have entered into My covenant by offering” But how do I realize “Wherefore I took an oath in My anger”? In My anger I took an oath, and I reconsidered
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: Yes, they come to the world, as it is stated, "Gather My pious ones to Me, those who make a covenant with Me through sacrifice." But how do I fulfill, "which I swore in My anger"? I swore in My anger and I will relent.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן קׇרְחָה אוֹמֵר לֹא נֶאֱמַר פָּסוּק זֶה אֶלָּא כְּנֶגֶד דּוֹרוֹת הַבָּאִים 'אִסְפוּ לִי חֲסִידָי'  אֵלּוּ צַדִּיקִים שֶׁבְּכָל דּוֹר וָדוֹר 'כֹּרְתֵי בְרִיתִי  עֲלֵי זָבַח' אֵלּוּ חֲנַנְיָה מִישָׁאֵל וַעֲזַרְיָה שֶׁמָּסְרוּ עַצְמָן לְתוֹךְ כִּבְשַׁן הָאֵשׁ 'עֲלֵי זָבַח'  [אֵלּוּ] רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא וַחֲבֵירָיו שֶׁמָּסְרוּ עַצְמָן לִשְׁחִיטָה עַל דִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korḥa says: This verse was stated only with regard to future generations, “Gather My pious together to Me”; these are the righteous that are in each and every generation. “Those that have entered into My covenant by offering”; these are Hananiah, Mishael, and Azariah, who submitted themselves to the fiery furnace “By offering”; this is Rabbi Akiva and his colleagues, who gave themselves up to slaughter over matters of Torah.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korcha says: This verse was not stated except in relation to future generations, "Gather My devout ones to Me," these are the righteous in every generation who fulfill My covenant upon sacrifices, these are Chananiah, Mishael, and Azariah who delivered themselves into the fiery furnace "upon sacrifices." These are Rabbi Akiva and his colleagues who delivered themselves to be slaughtered for matters of Torah.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן מְנַסְיָא אוֹמֵר בָּאִים הֵן לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר 'וּפְדוּיֵי ה' יְשֻׁבוּן וּבָאוּ צִיּוֹן בְּרִנָּה'  אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן שַׁבְקַהּ רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא לַחֲסִידוּתֵיהּ שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר הָלֹךְ וְקָרָאתָ בְאׇזְנֵי יְרוּשָׁלִַים לֵאמֹר זָכַרְתִּי לָךְ חֶסֶד נְעוּרַיִךְ אַהֲבַת כְּלוּלֹתָיִךְ לֶכְתֵּךְ אַחֲרַי בַּמִּדְבָּר בְּאֶרֶץ לֹא זְרוּעָה  וּמָה אֲחֵרִים בָּאִים בִּזְכוּתָם הֵם עַצְמָן לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Menasya says: comes to the World-to-Come, as it is stated: “And the redeemed of the Lord shall return and come singing into Zion” Rabba bar bar Ḥana says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Rabbi Akiva abandoned his piety as it is stated “Go and cry in the ears of Jerusalem saying, I remember for you the affection of your youth, the love of your espousals, how you went after Me in the wilderness, in a land that was not sown” Now, if others come in the merit of not all the more so themselves
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Menasya says: They are coming to the World to Come, as it is stated, "And the redeemed of the Lord shall return and come to Zion with singing." Rabbah bar bar Ḥana said that Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Rabbi Akiva left over for his piousness, as it is stated, "Go and call in the ears of Jerusalem, saying: Thus said the Lord: I remember in your favor the devotion of your youth, your love as a bride, how you followed Me in the wilderness, in a land not sown." And if others come due to their merit, they themselves not so much more so.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי' עֲשֶׂרֶת הַשְּׁבָטִים אֵינָן עֲתִידִין לַחֲזוֹר שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וַיַּשְׁלִכֵם אֶל אֶרֶץ אַחֶרֶת כַּיּוֹם הַזֶּה מָה הַיּוֹם הוֹלֵךְ וְאֵינוֹ חוֹזֵר  אַף הֵם הוֹלְכִים וְאֵינָן חוֹזְרִים דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר כַּיּוֹם הַזֶּה  מָה יוֹם מַאֲפִיל וּמֵאִיר  אַף עֲשֶׂרֶת הַשְּׁבָטִים שֶׁאֲפֵילָה לָהֶן כָּךְ עֲתִידָה לְהָאִיר לָהֶם
human_translation: The ten tribes are not destined to return as it is stated: “And He cast them into another land, as it is this day” Just as the day passes never to return, so too, go and do not return; the statement of Rabbi Akiva. Rabbi Eliezer says: “As it is this day,” just as the day darkens and brightens the ten tribes as well, it is dark for them so it is destined to brighten for them.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: The ten tribes will not return, as it is stated, "And He cast them into another land, as is this day" (Deuteronomy 29:27). Just as the day goes and does not return, so too they go and do not return. These are the words of Rabbi Akiva. Rabbi Eliezer says: Just as the day darkens and brightens, so too the ten tribes, even though darkness has been decreed upon them, it is destined to brighten for them.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ' תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן עֲשֶׂרֶת הַשְּׁבָטִים אֵין לָהֶם חֵלֶק לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר 'וַיִּתְּשֵׁם ה' מֵעַל אַדְמָתָם בְּאַף וּבְחֵמָה וּבְקֶצֶף גָּדוֹל' 'וַיִּתְּשֵׁם ה' מֵעַל אַדְמָתָם'  בְּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה 'וַיַּשְׁלִכֵם אֶל אֶרֶץ אַחֶרֶת'  לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יְהוּדָה אִישׁ כְּפַר עַכּוֹ אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אִם מַעֲשֵׂיהֶם כַּיּוֹם הַזֶּה  אֵינָן חוֹזְרִין וְאִם לָאו  חוֹזְרִין
human_translation: The Sages taught The ten tribes have no share in the World-to-Come, as it is stated: “And the Lord rooted them out of their land in anger, and in wrath, and in great indignation; “And the Lord rooted them out of their land” in this world; “and cast them into another land” for the World-to-Come; the statement of Rabbi Akiva. Rabbi Shimon ben Yehuda of the village of Akko says in the name of Rabbi Shimon: If their actions “as it is this day” they do not return And if not, they return
llm_translation: The Sages taught: The ten tribes have no portion in the World to Come, as it is stated, "And the Lord uprooted them from their land in anger, wrath, and great indignation" (2 Kings 17:20). "And the Lord uprooted them from their land" - in this world. "And cast them into another land" - in the World to Come. These are the words of Rabbi Akiva. Rabbi Shimon ben Yehuda, a man of Kefar Akko, says in the name of Rabbi Shimon: If their deeds are like today, they do not return; and if not, they return.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אוֹמֵר בָּאִים הֵם לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר 'בַּיּוֹם הַהוּא יִתָּקַע בְּשׁוֹפָר גָּדוֹל' וְגוֹ' אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן שַׁבְקַהּ רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא לַחֲסִידוּתֵיהּ שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר הָלֹךְ וְקָרָאתָ אֶת הַדְּבָרִים הָאֵלֶּה צָפוֹנָה וְאָמַרְתָּ שׁוּבָה מְשֻׁבָה יִשְׂרָאֵל נְאֻם ה' לוֹא אַפִּיל פָּנַי בָּכֶם כִּי חָסִיד אֲנִי נְאֻם ה' לֹא אֶטּוֹר לְעוֹלָם
human_translation: Rabbi says: come to the World-to-Come, as it is stated: “And it shall come to pass on that day, that a great shofar will be sounded, Rabba bar bar Ḥana says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Rabbi Akiva abandoned his piety as it is stated “Go and proclaim these words toward the north, and say: Return you faithless Israel, says the Lord; I will not frown upon you; for I am merciful, says the Lord, and I will not bear a grudge forever”
llm_translation: Rabbi says they are coming to the world that is coming, as it is stated, "On that day a great shofar will be sounded," etc. Rabbah bar bar Ḥana said that Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Rabbi Akiva left his Hasidism, as it is stated, "Go and proclaim these words to the north and say: Return, rebellious Israel—declares the Lord. I will not look at you in anger, for I am merciful—declares the Lord. I will not bear a grudge forever."

hebrew_text: מַאי חֲסִידוּתֵיהּ דְּתַנְיָא קְטַנֵּי בְּנֵי רִשְׁעֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל אֵין בָּאִין לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר 'כִּי הִנֵּה הַיּוֹם בָּא בֹּעֵר כַּתַּנּוּר וְהָיוּ כׇל זֵדִים וְכׇל עֹשֵׂה רִשְׁעָה קַשׁ וְלִהַט אֹתָם הַיּוֹם הַבָּא אָמַר ה' צְבָאוֹת אֲשֶׁר לֹא יַעֲזֹב לָהֶם שֹׁרֶשׁ וְעָנָף' 'שֹׁרֶשׁ'  בָּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה 'וְעָנָף'  לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא דִּבְרֵי רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל
human_translation: What is the piety of as it is taught The minor children of the wicked of the Jewish people, do not come into the World-to-Come, as it is stated: “For behold the day is coming; it burns like a furnace, and all the arrogant and all who do wickedly shall be straw; and the day that is coming shall burn them up, says the Lord of hosts, so that it will leave them neither root nor branch” a root in this world a branch in the World-to-Come; the statement of Rabban Gamliel.
llm_translation: What is the piety of one who teaches that the young children of wicked people from Israel do not come to the world to come? As it is stated, "For behold, the day is coming, burning like a furnace, and all the arrogant and every evildoer will be chaff; and the day that is coming will set them ablaze," says the Lord of hosts, "so that it will leave them neither root nor branch." "Root" in this world, "and branch" in the world to come. These are the words of Rabban Gamliel.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר בָּאִים הֵם לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר 'שֹׁמֵר פְּתָאִים ה'' שֶׁכֵּן קוֹרִין בִּכְרַכֵּי הַיָּם לְיָנוֹקָא פַּתְיָא וְאוֹמֵר 'גֹּדּוּ אִילָנָא וְחַבְּלוּהִי בְּרַם עִקַּר שׇׁרְשׁוֹהִי בְּאַרְעָא שְׁבֻקוּ' וְאֶלָּא מָה אֲנִי מְקַיֵּים 'לֹא יַעֲזֹב לָהֶם שֹׁרֶשׁ וְעָנָף'  שֶׁלֹּא יַנִּיחַ לָהֶם לֹא מִצְוָה וְלֹא שִׁיּוּרֵי מִצְוָה דָּבָר אַחֵר 'שֹׁרֶשׁ'  זוֹ נְשָׁמָה 'וְעָנָף'  זֶה הַגּוּף
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: They come into the World-to-Come, as it is stated: “The Lord preserves the simple [ peta’im ]” as in the cities overseas call a child patya . And states “Hew down the tree and destroy it; yet leave the stump of its roots in the earth” But how do I realize “So that it will leave them neither root nor branch”? will not leave for a mitzva nor the remnants of a mitzva Alternatively, “root”; this soul. “Nor branch”; this the body.
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: They come to the World to Come, as it is stated, "The Lord guards the simple" (Psalms 116:6). Similarly, they are called in the chambers of the sea "simple" (Job 26:12). And it says, "Cut down the tree and uproot it, but leave its roots in the ground, with a band of iron and bronze" (Daniel 4:10). But how do I fulfill "He will not abandon its roots and branches" (Job 14:8)? That He will not leave them without a commandment or the remnants of a commandment. Another explanation: "Root" refers to the soul, and "branch" refers to the body.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל קְטַנֵּי בְּנֵי רִשְׁעֵי אוּמּוֹת הָעוֹלָם דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל אֵין בָּאִין לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא וְרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל נָפְקָא לֵיהּ מִוַּתְּאַבֵּד כׇּל זֵכֶר לָמוֹ
human_translation: But everyone agrees the minor children of the wicked of the nations of the world will not come into the World-to-Come, And Rabban Gamliel derives from “And you have caused all their memory to perish”
llm_translation: But the young children of the wicked, the nations of the world, everyone agrees they have no portion in the World to Come. And Rabban Gamliel derived from it: "All memory of them shall perish."

hebrew_text: אִתְּמַר קָטָן מֵאֵימָתַי בָּא לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא רַבִּי חִיָּיא וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בַּר רַבִּי חַד אָמַר מִשָּׁעָה שֶׁנּוֹלַד וְחַד אָמַר מִשָּׁעָה שֶׁסִּיפֵּר מַאן דְּאָמַר מִשָּׁעָה שֶׁנּוֹלַד שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר יָבֹאוּ וְיַגִּידוּ צִדְקָתוֹ לְעַם נוֹלָד כִּי עָשָׂה וּמַאן דְּאָמַר מִשָּׁעָה שֶׁסִּיפֵּר דִּכְתִיב זֶרַע יַעַבְדֶנּוּ יְסֻפַּר לַה' לַדּוֹר
human_translation: It was stated: a minor from when, does he come into the World-to-Come? Rabbi Ḥiyya and Rabbi Shimon bar Rabbi One says: From the moment that he is born, and one says: From the moment that talk. The one who says: From the moment that he is born, that is stated: “They shall come and shall declare His righteousness to a people that shall be born, that He has done this” And the one who says: From the moment that talk, that is written: “Their seed shall serve Him; it shall be told of the Lord to the coming generation”
llm_translation: It was stated: From when does a child come into the world? One said: From the moment he is born, and one said: From the moment he begins to speak. The one who said: From the moment he is born, as it is stated, "Let them come and declare His righteousness to a people that shall be born, that He has done this." And the one who said: From the moment he begins to speak, as it is written, "His seed shall serve Him; it shall be told of the Lord to the next generation."

hebrew_text: אִתְּמַר רָבִינָא אָמַר מִשָּׁעָה שֶׁנִּזְרַע דִּכְתִיב זֶרַע יַעַבְדֶנּוּ רַבִּי נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק אָמַר מִשָּׁעָה שֶׁנִּימּוֹל דִּכְתִיב עָנִי אֲנִי וְגֹוֵעַ מִנֹּעַר נָשָׂאתִי אֵמֶיךָ אָפוּנָה
human_translation: It was stated Ravina says: From the moment that is conceived, as it is written: “Their seed shall serve Him” Rabbi Naḥman bar Yitzḥak says: From the moment that he is circumcised, as it is written: “I am poor and close to death from youth; I suffered your terrors [ emekha ], I am numb”
llm_translation: It was stated: Ravina said, from the time of sowing, as it is written, "He shall serve him with seed." Rabbi Nachman bar Yitzchak said, from the time of circumcision, as it is written, "I am poor and of a broken heart; I have borne Thy terrors."

hebrew_text: תָּנָא מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי מֵאִיר מִשָּׁעָה שֶׁיֹּאמַר אָמֵן שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר 'פִּתְחוּ שְׁעָרִים וְיָבֹא גוֹי צַדִּיק שֹׁמֵר אֱמֻנִים' אַל תִּקְרֵי 'שֹׁמֵר אֱמֻנִים' אֶלָּא 'שֶׁאוֹמֵר אָמֵן'
human_translation: taught in the name of Rabbi Meir: From the moment that will say amen, as it is stated: “Open the gates, so that the righteous nation that keeps faithfulness may enter” Do not read “that keeps faithfulness [ shomer emunim ]”; rather, That says amen [ she’omer amen ].
llm_translation: It was taught in the name of Rabbi Meir: From the moment one says 'Amen,' as it is stated, "Open the gates, that the righteous nation that keeps faithfulness may enter" (Isaiah 26:2). Do not read it as "that keeps faithfulness," rather, "that says 'Amen.'"

hebrew_text: מַאי אָמֵן אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא אֵל מֶלֶךְ נֶאֱמָן
human_translation: What amen? Rabbi Ḥanina says: God, faithful King [ El Melekh ne’eman ].
llm_translation: What is the meaning of "Amen"? Rabbi Chanina said: "God, the faithful King."

hebrew_text: לָכֵן הִרְחִיבָה שְּׁאוֹל נַפְשָׁהּ וּפָעֲרָה פִיהָ לִבְלִי חֹק אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ לְמִי שֶׁמְּשַׁיֵּיר אֲפִילּוּ חוֹק אֶחָד  אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן לָא נִיחָא לְמָרַיְיהוּ דְּאָמְרַתְּ לְהוּ הָכִי אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ לֹא לָמַד אֶלָּא חוֹק אֶחָד
human_translation: “Therefore, the netherworld has enlarged itself and opened its mouth without measure [ livli ḥok ]” Reish Lakish says: one who leaves even one statute [ ḥok ] Rabbi Yoḥanan says: It is not satisfactory to their Master, that you said this about them, Rather, even if one learned only one statute,
llm_translation: Therefore, Sheol has enlarged its desire and opened its mouth without limit. Resh Lakish said: For one who reviews, even one law, Rabbi Yochanan said: It is not pleasing to their Master if you say to them thus, but even if they did not learn except for one law.

hebrew_text: (שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר) וְהָיָה בְכׇל הָאָרֶץ נְאֻם ה' פִּי שְׁנַיִם בָּהּ יִכָּרְתוּ יִגְוָעוּ וְהַשְּׁלִישִׁית יִוָּתֶר בָּהּ אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ  שְׁלִישִׁי שֶׁל שֵׁם אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן לָא נִיחָא לְמָרַיְיהוּ דְּאָמְרַתְּ לְהוּ הָכִי אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ שְׁלִישִׁי שֶׁל נֹחַ
human_translation: that is stated: “And it shall come to pass that in all the land, says the Lord, two parts shall be excised and die, but the third shall remain in it” Reish Lakish says: one-third of Shem, Rabbi Yoḥanan said to It is not satisfactory to their Master, that you said this about them, Rather, even one-third of Noah,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: (שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר) וְהָיָה בְכׇל הָאָרֶץ נְאֻם ה' פִּי שְׁנַיִם בָּהּ יִכָּרְתוּ יִגְוָעוּ וְהַשְּׁלִישִׁית יִוָּתֶר בָּהּ אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ שְׁלִישִׁי שֶׁל שֵׁם אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן לָא נִיחָא לְמָרַיְיהוּ דְּאָמְרַתְּ לְהוּ הָכִי אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ שְׁלִישִׁי שֶׁל נֹחַ English translation: (As it is stated) "And it shall come to pass in all the land," declares the Lord, "two parts in it shall be cut off and perish, but the third shall be left in it." Resh Lakish said: The third part of the name. Rabbi Yochanan said to him: It is not pleasing to their Master that you say so, but rather, even the third part of Noah.

hebrew_text: כִּי אָנֹכִי בָּעַלְתִּי בָכֶם וְלָקַחְתִּי אֶתְכֶם אֶחָד מֵעִיר וּשְׁנַיִם מִמִּשְׁפָּחָה אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ דְּבָרִים כִּכְתָבָן אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן לָא נִיחָא לֵיהּ לְמָרַיְיהוּ דְּאָמְרַתְּ לְהוּ הָכִי אֶלָּא אֶחָד מֵעִיר מְזַכֶּה כָּל הָעִיר כּוּלָּהּ וּשְׁנַיִם מִמִּשְׁפָּחָה מְזַכִּין כָּל הַמִּשְׁפָּחָה כּוּלָּהּ יָתֵיב רַב כָּהֲנָא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב וְיָתֵיב וְקָאָמַר דְּבָרִים כִּכְתָבָן אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב לָא נִיחָא לֵיהּ לְמָרַיְיהוּ דְּאָמְרַתְּ לְהוּ הָכִי אֶלָּא אֶחָד מֵעִיר מְזַכֶּה כָּל הָעִיר וּשְׁנַיִם מִמִּשְׁפָּחָה מְזַכִּין כָּל הַמִּשְׁפָּחָה
human_translation: “For I have taken you to Myself: And I will take out one of a city, and two of a family” Reish Lakish says: statement as it is written, Rabbi Yoḥanan said to him: It is not satisfactory to their Master, that you said this about them. Rather, one from the city causes the entire city benefit, and two from a family causes the entire family benefit Rav Kahana sat before Rav, and sat and said: this statement as it is written. Rav said to him: It is not satisfactory to their Master, that you said this about them. Rather, one from the city causes the entire city benefit, and two from a family causes the entire family benefit
llm_translation: "When I take you, one from a city and two from a family, and I will bring you to Zion." Reish Lakish said: The words are as they are written. Rabbi Yochanan said to him: It is not pleasing to their Master that you say this, but rather, one from a city merits the entire city, and two from a family merit the entire family. Rav Kahana was sitting before Rav and he was sitting and saying: The words are as they are written. Rav said to him: It is not pleasing to their Master that you say this, but rather, one from a city merits the entire city, and two from a family merit the entire family.

hebrew_text: חַזְיֵיהּ דַּהֲוָה קָא חָיֵיף רֵישֵׁיהּ וְסָלֵיק וְיָתֵיב קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב אֲמַר לֵיהּ וְלֹא תִמָּצֵא בְּאֶרֶץ הַחַיִּים אֲמַר לֵיהּ מֵילָט קָא לָיְיטַתְּ לִי אֲמַר לֵיהּ קְרָא קָאָמֵינָא לֹא תִּמָּצֵא תּוֹרָה בְּמִי שֶׁמְּחַיֶּה עַצְמוֹ עָלֶיהָ
human_translation: saw that was washing his head and arose and sat before Rav. said to “Nor shall it be found in the land of the living [ haḥayyim ]” he said to Are you cursing me? said to him: a verse I am saying Torah will not be found in one who sustains [ meḥayye ] himself in its
llm_translation: His eyes that were closed opened, and he got up and sat before Rav. He said to him, "And you will not find in the land of the living." He said to him, "I am seeking refuge with you." He said to him, "It is a verse that I am saying: 'You will not find Torah in one who sustains himself with it.'"

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא רַב סִימַאי אוֹמֵר נֶאֱמַר 'וְלָקַחְתִּי אֶתְכֶם לִי לְעָם' וְנֶאֱמַר 'וְהֵבֵאתִי אֶתְכֶם' מַקִּישׁ יְצִיאָתָן מִמִּצְרַיִם לְבִיאָתָן לָאָרֶץ  מָה בִּיאָתָן לָאָרֶץ שְׁנַיִם מִשִּׁשִּׁים רִיבּוֹא אַף יְצִיאָתָן מִמִּצְרַיִם שְׁנַיִם מִשִּׁשִּׁים רִיבּוֹא אָמַר רָבָא וְכֵן לִימוֹת הַמָּשִׁיחַ שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וְעָנְתָה שָּׁמָּה כִּימֵי נְעוּרֶיהָ וּכְיוֹם עֲלוֹתָהּ מֵאֶרֶץ מִצְרָיִם
human_translation: It is taught Rav Simai says it is stated: “And I will take you to Me as a people” and it is stated: “And I will bring you compares their exodus from Egypt to their entry into the land; just as their entry into the land two of six hundred thousand so too, their exodus from Egypt, only two of six hundred thousand Rava says: And likewise, in the messianic era, as it is stated: “And she shall respond there, as in the days of her youth, and as in the day when she came up out of the land of Egypt”
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Rav Simai says, it is stated, "And I will take you to Me as a people," and it is stated, "And I will bring you." He compares their exiting from Egypt to their coming to the land. Just as their coming to the land was two out of sixty myriads, so too their exiting from Egypt was two out of sixty myriads. Rava said: And so too in the days of the Messiah, as it is stated, "And she will respond there as in the days of her youth, and as on the day she ascended from the land of Egypt."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי פַּעַם אַחַת נִכְנַסְתִּי לַאֲלֶכְּסַנְדְּרִיָּא שֶׁל מִצְרַיִם מָצָאתִי זָקֵן אֶחָד וְאָמַר לִי בֹּא וְאַרְאֶךָּ מָה עָשׂוּ אֲבוֹתַי לַאֲבוֹתֶיךָ מֵהֶם טִבְּעוּ בַּיָּם מֵהֶם הָרְגוּ בַּחֶרֶב מֵהֶם מָעֲכוּ בְּבִנְיָן וְעַל דָּבָר זֶה נֶעֱנַשׁ מֹשֶׁה רַבֵּינוּ שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וּמֵאָז בָּאתִי אֶל פַּרְעֹה לְדַבֵּר בִּשְׁמֶךָ הֵרַע לָעָם הַזֶּה
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Yosei, says: One time I entered Alexandria of Egypt. I found one old man and he said to me: Come and I will show you what my ancestors, did to your ancestors, of them they drowned in the sea, of them they killed with the sword, some of them they crushed in the buildings. And over this matter, Moses, our teacher, was punished, as it is stated: “For since I came to Pharaoh to speak in Your name, he has done evil to this people,
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Yosei, said, "Once I entered the Alexandrian synagogue in Egypt and found an elderly man who said to me, 'Come and I will show you what your ancestors did to my ancestors. Some of them drowned in the sea, some were killed by the sword, some were crushed in buildings.' And because of this, our teacher Moses was punished, as it is said, 'But since I came to Pharaoh to speak in Your name, he has dealt worse with this people.'"

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא חֲבָל עַל דְּאָבְדִין וְלָא מִשְׁתַּכְחִין הֲרֵי כַּמָּה פְּעָמִים נִגְלֵיתִי עַל אַבְרָהָם יִצְחָק וְיַעֲקֹב בְּאֵל שַׁדַּי וְלֹא הִרְהֲרוּ עַל מִדּוֹתַי וְלֹא אָמְרוּ לִי 'מַה שְּׁמֶךָ' אָמַרְתִּי לְאַבְרָהָם 'קוּם הִתְהַלֵּךְ בָּאָרֶץ לְאׇרְכָּהּ וּלְרׇחְבָּהּ כִּי לְךָ אֶתְּנֶנָּה' בִּקֵּשׁ מָקוֹם לִקְבּוֹר אֶת שָׂרָה וְלֹא מָצָא עַד שֶׁקָּנָה בְּאַרְבַּע מֵאוֹת שֶׁקֶל כֶּסֶף וְלֹא הִרְהֵר עַל מִדּוֹתַי
human_translation: The Holy One, Blessed be He, said to Woe over those who are gone and are no found; as several times I revealed Myself to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob as God Almighty [ El Shaddai ] and they did not question My attributes, and did not say to Me: What is Your name? I said to Abraham: “Arise, walk through the land in the length of it and in the breadth of it; for unto you I will give it” he sought a place to bury Sarah and did not find until he purchased for four hundred silver shekels, and he did not question My attributes
llm_translation: He said to him, the Holy One, blessed be He, "Woe to those who are lost and not found. How many times have I revealed Myself to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob as El Shaddai, and they did not contemplate My attributes, nor did they say to Me, 'What is Your name?' I said to Abraham, 'Arise, walk through the land in its length and in its breadth, for to you I will give it.' He sought a place to bury Sarah and did not find until he acquired for four hundred shekels of silver, and he did not contemplate My attributes."

hebrew_text: אָמַרְתִּי לְיִצְחָק 'גּוּר בָּאָרֶץ הַזֹּאת וְאֶהְיֶה עִמְּךָ וַאֲבָרְכֶךָּ' בִּקְּשׁוּ עֲבָדָיו מַיִם לִשְׁתּוֹת וְלֹא מָצְאוּ עַד שֶׁעָשׂוּ מְרִיבָה שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וַיָּרִיבוּ רֹעֵי גְרָר עִם רֹעֵי יִצְחָק לֵאמֹר לָנוּ הַמָּיִם' וְלֹא הִרְהֵר אַחַר מִדּוֹתַי
human_translation: I said to Isaac: “Sojourn in this land, and I will be with you and will bless you” His servants sought water to drink and they did not find until they started a quarrel, as it is stated: “And the herdsmen of Gerar quarreled with Isaac’s herdsmen saying: The water is ours” and he did not question My attributes.
llm_translation: I said to Isaac, "Dwell in this land, and I will be with you and bless you." His servants sought water to drink but did not find until they made a dispute, as it is said, "And the herdsmen of Gerar quarreled with Isaac's herdsmen, saying, 'The water is ours.'" And he did not hesitate after my attributes.

hebrew_text: אָמַרְתִּי לְיַעֲקֹב 'הָאָרֶץ אֲשֶׁר אַתָּה שֹׁכֵב עָלֶיהָ לְךָ אֶתְּנֶנָּה' בִּיקֵּשׁ מָקוֹם לִנְטוֹעַ אׇהֳלוֹ וְלֹא מָצָא עַד שֶׁקָּנָה בְּמֵאָה קְשִׂיטָה וְלֹא הִרְהֵר אַחַר מִדּוֹתַי וְלֹא אָמְרוּ לִי 'מַה שְּׁמֶךָ' וְאַתָּה אָמְרַתְּ לִי 'מַה שְּׁמֶךָ' בַּתְּחִלָּה וְעַכְשָׁיו אַתָּה אוֹמֵר לִי 'וְהַצֵּל לֹא הִצַּלְתָּ אֶת עַמֶּךָ' 'עַתָּה תִרְאֶה אֵת אֲשֶׁר אֶעֱשֶׂה לְפַרְעֹה' בְּמִלְחֶמֶת פַּרְעֹה אַתָּה רוֹאֶה וְאִי אַתָּה רוֹאֶה בְּמִלְחֶמֶת שְׁלֹשִׁים וְאֶחָד מְלָכִים
human_translation: I said to Jacob: “The land upon which you lie, to you I will give it” He sought a place to pitch his tent and he did not find until he purchased for one hundred coins, and he did not question My attributes, and did not say to Me: What is Your name? And you, ask Me: What is Your name, initially, And now you say to Me: “Neither have You delivered Your people” “Now shall you see what I will do to Pharaoh” The war with Pharaoh you see, but you will not see the war with the thirty-one kings
llm_translation: I said to Jacob, 'The land on which you lie, to you I will give it.' He sought a place to pitch his tent, but did not find until he acquired with a hundred kesitah, and did not hesitate from my measures, and they did not say to me, 'What is your name?' and you said to me, 'What is your name?' at first, and now you say to me, 'And you have not saved your people.' 'Now you will see what I will do to Pharaoh' in the war of Pharaoh you see, but you do not see in the war of thirty-one kings.

hebrew_text: וַיְמַהֵר מֹשֶׁה וַיִּקֹּד אַרְצָה וַיִּשְׁתָּחוּ מָה רָאָה מֹשֶׁה
human_translation: and Moses made haste and bowed his head toward the earth and prostrated himself” What did Moses see
llm_translation: And he hastened Moses and he bowed to the ground, what did Moses see.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בֶּן גַּמְלָא אָמַר אֶרֶךְ אַפַּיִם רָאָה וְרַבָּנַן אָמְרִי אֱמֶת רָאָה תַּנְיָא כְּמַאן דְּאָמַר אֶרֶךְ אַפַּיִם רָאָה דְּתַנְיָא כְּשֶׁעָלָה מֹשֶׁה לְמָרוֹם מְצָאוֹ לְהַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא שֶׁיּוֹשֵׁב וְכוֹתֵב 'אֶרֶךְ אַפַּיִם' אָמַר לְפָנָיו 'רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם' אֶרֶךְ אַפַּיִם לַצַּדִּיקִים אָמַר לוֹ 'אַף לָרְשָׁעִים' אֲמַר לֵיהּ 'רְשָׁעִים יֹאבֵדוּ' אֲמַר לֵיהּ 'הַשְׁתָּא חָזֵית (מַאי) דְּמִבְּעֵי לָךְ'
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina ben Gamla says: He saw slow to anger; and the Rabbis say: He saw truth. It is taught in accordance with the one who said: He saw slow to anger, as it is taught When Moses ascended on high, he discovered the Holy One, Blessed be He, sitting and writing: Slow to anger. said before Him: Master of the Universe, slow to anger for the righteous? said to him: even for the wicked. said to Him: Let the wicked be doomed. said to him: Now, you see that you will need
llm_translation: Rabbi Chanina ben Gamla said: Long of anger he saw, and the Rabbis say: Truth he saw. It was taught in a Baraita: In whose manner did Rabbi Chanina ben Gamla say, "Long of anger he saw"? As it was taught: When Moses ascended on high, he found the Holy One, blessed be He, sitting and writing, "Long of anger." He said before Him, "Master of the Universe, long of anger for the righteous?" He said to him, "Also for the wicked." He said to him, "The wicked will perish." He said to him, "Do you see what I desire?"

hebrew_text: כְּשֶׁחָטְאוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל אָמַר לוֹ 'לֹא כָּךְ אָמַרְתָּ לִי אֶרֶךְ אַפַּיִם לַצַּדִּיקִים'
human_translation: When the Jewish people sinned said to Didn’t you say to Me slow to anger for the righteous
llm_translation: When Israel sinned, He said to him, "This is not what you told me: 'Long-suffering towards the righteous.'"

hebrew_text: אָמַר לְפָנָיו 'רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם וְלֹא כָּךְ אָמַרְתָּ לִי אַף לָרְשָׁעִים' וְהַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב 'וְעַתָּה יִגְדַּל נָא כֹּחַ ה' כַּאֲשֶׁר דִּבַּרְתָּ לֵאמֹר'
human_translation: said before Him: Master of the Universe, and isn’t this You said to me: even for the wicked? And that is which is written: “And now, I pray You, let the power of my Lord be great, as You have spoken, saying”
llm_translation: He said before Him, "Master of the universe, and this is not what You said to me, even to the wicked." And this is what is written, "And now, let the power of the Lord be great, as You have spoken, saying."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי חַגָּא הֲוָה סָלֵיק וְאָזֵיל בְּדַרְגָּא דְּבֵי רַבָּה בַּר שֵׁילָא שַׁמְעֵיהּ לְהָהוּא יָנוֹקָא דְּאָמַר עֵדֹתֶיךָ נֶאֶמְנוּ מְאֹד לְבֵיתְךָ נַאֲוָה קֹדֶשׁ ה' לְאֹרֶךְ יָמִים וּסְמִיךְ לֵיהּ תְּפִלָּה לְמֹשֶׁה וְגוֹ' אֲמַר שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ אֶרֶךְ אַפַּיִם רָאָה
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥagga was walking up the stairs in the school of Rabba bar Sheila. He heard a certain child who said: “Your testimonies are very sure; sanctity becomes Your house, Lord, for the length of days” And juxtaposed to it “A prayer of Moses” said: Conclude from it slow to anger saw.
llm_translation: Rabbi Ḥagga was ascending and going in the step of the house of Rabba bar Sheilah, he heard that young child saying: "Your testimonies are very trustworthy; holiness befits Your house, O Lord, for length of days, and attached to it is the prayer of Moses, etc." He said: Learn from it that He is slow to anger and sees.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא עָתִיד הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לִהְיוֹת עֲטָרָה בְּרֹאשׁ כׇּל צַדִּיק וְצַדִּיק שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר בַּיּוֹם הַהוּא יִהְיֶה ה' צְבָאוֹת לַעֲטֶרֶת צְבִי וְלִצְפִירַת תִּפְאָרָה לִשְׁאָר עַמּוֹ וְגוֹ' מַאי לַעֲטֶרֶת צְבִי וְלִצְפִירַת תִּפְאָרָה לָעוֹשִׂים רְצוֹנוֹ וּמְצַפִּים לִישׁוּעָתוֹ יָכוֹל לַכֹּל תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר לִשְׁאָר עַמּוֹ לְמִי שֶׁמֵּשִׂים עַצְמוֹ כְּשִׁירַיִם
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar says Rabbi Ḥanina says: The Holy One, Blessed be He, is destined to be a crown on the head of each and every righteous as it is stated: “In that day shall the Lord of hosts be for a crown of glory, and for a diadem of beauty, unto the remnant of His people” What is “For a crown of glory, and for a diadem of beauty”? for those who perform His will and for those who await His salvation. might to everyone the verse states: “Unto the remnant of His people,” to one who establishes himself like a remnant,
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said, Rabbi Chanina said: The Holy One, blessed be He, is destined to be a crown on the head of every righteous person, as it is stated, "In that day shall the Lord of hosts be for a crown of glory, and for a diadem of beauty, unto the residue of His people" (Isaiah 28:5). What is meant by "a crown of glory, and for a diadem of beauty"? For those who do His will and eagerly await His salvation. It is possible to interpret "unto the residue of His people" as referring to those who make themselves like the remnant.

hebrew_text: וּלְרוּחַ מִשְׁפָּט לַיּוֹשֵׁב עַל הַמִּשְׁפָּט וְלִגְבוּרָה מְשִׁיבֵי מִלְחָמָה שָׁעְרָה וּלְרוּחַ מִשְׁפָּט  זֶה הָרוֹדֶה אֶת יִצְרוֹ וְלַיּוֹשֵׁב עַל הַמִּשְׁפָּט  זֶה הַדָּן דִּין אֱמֶת לַאֲמִיתּוֹ וְלִגְבוּרָה  זֶה הַמִּתְגַּבֵּר בְּיִצְרוֹ מְשִׁיבֵי מִלְחָמָה  זֶה שֶׁנּוֹשֵׂא וְנוֹתֵן בְּמִלְחַמְתָּהּ שֶׁל תּוֹרָה שָׁעְרָה  אֵלּוּ שֶׁמַּשְׁכִּימִין וּמַעֲרִיבִין בְּבָתֵּי כְנֵסִיּוֹת וּבָתֵּי מִדְרָשׁוֹת
human_translation: “And for a spirit of justice to him that sits in judgment and for strength to them who retaliate in battle to the gate” “And for a spirit of justice”; this one who subdues his inclination “To him that sits in judgment”; this one who judges a true judgment truthfully. “And for strength”; this one who overcomes his inclination. “Them who retaliate in battle”; this who gives and takes in the battle, of Torah. “To the gate” those who arrive early and remain late within synagogues and study halls.
llm_translation: And for the spirit of judgment to the one who sits in judgment, and for strength to those who turn the battle back; and for the spirit of judgment - this is one who rules over his inclination. And to the one who sits in judgment - this is one who judges true judgment to its truth. And for strength - this is one who overcomes his inclination, those who turn the battle back - this is one who engages in and deliberates in the battle of Torah. These are those who rise early and stay late in the synagogues and study halls.

hebrew_text: אָמְרָה מִדַּת הַדִּין לִפְנֵי הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם מָה נִשְׁתַּנּוּ אֵלּוּ מֵאֵלּוּ אָמַר לָהּ וְגַם אֵלֶּה בַּיַּיִן שָׁגוּ וּבַשֵּׁכָר תָּעוּ [וְגוֹ'] פָּקוּ פְּלִילִיָּה וְאֵין פּוּקָה אֶלָּא גֵּיהִנָּם שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר לֹא תִהְיֶה זֹאת לְךָ לְפוּקָה וְאֵין פְּלִילָה אֶלָּא דַּיָּינִין שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וְנָתַן בִּפְלִלִים
human_translation: The attribute of justice said before the Holy One, Blessed be He: Master of the Universe, how do these differ from those said to “These also reel through wine, and stagger through strong drink…they stumble [ paku ] in judgment [ peliliyya ]” And puka nothing other than Gehenna, as it is stated: “That this shall not be a cause of stumbling [ puka ] for you” And pelila nothing other than judges, as it is stated: “And he shall pay as the judges [ biflilim ] determine”
llm_translation: The measure of justice said before the Holy One, blessed be He: "Master of the world, how do these differ from those?" He said to her, "Even these erred in wine, and in intoxicating drink they went astray." Penalty is exacted and there is no escape except to Gehinnom, as it is said, "This shall not be for you an escape." And penalty is nothing but judgments, as it is said, "And he shall give in judgments."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי' אַנְשֵׁי עִיר הַנִּדַּחַת אֵין לָהֶם חֵלֶק לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר יָצְאוּ אֲנָשִׁים בְּנֵי בְלִיַּעַל מִקִּרְבֶּךָ וַיַּדִּיחוּ אֶת יֹשְׁבֵי עִירָם לֵאמֹר וְאֵינָן נֶהֱרָגִים עַד שֶׁיִּהְיוּ מַדִּיחֶיהָ מֵאוֹתָהּ הָעִיר וּמֵאוֹתוֹ הַשֵּׁבֶט וְעַד שֶׁיּוּדַח רוּבָּהּ וְעַד שֶׁיַּדִּיחוּהָ אֲנָשִׁים הִדִּיחוּהָ נָשִׁים וּקְטַנִּים אוֹ שֶׁהוּדַּח מִיעוּטָהּ אוֹ שֶׁהָיוּ מַדִּיחֶיהָ חוּצָה לָהּ  הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ כִּיחִידִים וּצְרִיכִין שְׁנֵי עֵדִים וְהַתְרָאָה לְכׇל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד
human_translation: The residents of an idolatrous city have no share in the World-to-Come, as it is stated: “Certain men, wicked persons, are gone out from your midst, and have subverted the inhabitants of their city, saying: And are not executed unless its subverters are from that city and from that tribe, and unless most of are subverted, and unless men subvert women or children subvert or that a minority of were subverted, or that its subverters were from outside these are as individuals. And one requires two witnesses and forewarning for each and every one
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: The people of a city that has been designated for destruction have no portion in the World to Come, as it is stated, "Certain base fellows have gone out from among you and have seduced the inhabitants of their city, saying, 'Let us go and serve other gods'—whom you have not known—then you shall inquire, search out, and ask diligently. And if it is true and the matter is established that such an abomination has been committed among you, you shall surely strike down the inhabitants of that city with the edge of the sword, utterly destroying it and all that is in it, and its cattle with the edge of the sword" (Deuteronomy 13:14-16). And they are not killed until they have driven out the inhabitants of the city, and the tribe, and until its majority has been driven out, and until men have driven it out, women and children, or if a minority has driven it out, or if they were driven out beyond its borders—these are considered as individuals, and require two witnesses and a warning for each and every one.

hebrew_text: זֶה חוֹמֶר בַּיְחִידִים מִבַּמְרוּבִּים  שֶׁהַיְּחִידִים בִּסְקִילָה לְפִיכָךְ מָמוֹנָם פָּלֵט וְהַמְרוּבִּין בְּסַיִיף לְפִיכָךְ מָמוֹנָם אָבֵד
human_translation: This is a stringency with regard to individuals than with regard to multitudes As the individuals by stoning; therefore, their property is spared And the multitudes by the sword; their property is eliminated.
llm_translation: This is the difference between individuals and the majority: individuals are punished by stoning, therefore their money is saved; while the majority are executed by the sword, therefore their money is lost.

hebrew_text: הַכֵּה תַכֶּה אֶת יֹשְׁבֵי הָעִיר הַזֹּאת לְפִי חֶרֶב הַחַמֶּרֶת וְהַגַּמֶּלֶת הָעוֹבֶרֶת מִמָּקוֹם לְמָקוֹם  הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ מַצִּילִין אוֹתָהּ
human_translation: “You shall smite the inhabitants of that city with the edge of the sword” the caravan of donkeys and the caravan of camels that move from place to place, these save
llm_translation: Strike, you shall strike the inhabitants of this city with the edge of the sword, the men, the women, the children, and the infants, and the ox, and the sheep, and the donkey, all that is in the city, you shall take as spoil for yourself, and you shall eat the spoil of your enemies, which the Lord your God has given you.

hebrew_text: שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר הַחֲרֵם אֹתָהּ וְאֶת כׇּל אֲשֶׁר בָּהּ וְאֶת בְּהֶמְתָּהּ לְפִי חָרֶב מִכָּאן אָמְרוּ נִכְסֵי צַדִּיקִים שֶׁבְּתוֹכָהּ  אוֹבְדִין שֶׁבְּחוּצָה לָהּ פְּלֵיטִין וְשֶׁל רְשָׁעִים בֵּין שֶׁבְּתוֹכָהּ בֵּין שֶׁבְּחוּצָה לָהּ  הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ אוֹבְדִין
human_translation: It is stated: “Destroy it utterly, and all that is in it and its animals, with the edge of the sword” From here, stated: The property of the righteous, that is inside is destroyed that is outside is spared. And of the wicked, whether inside or whether it is outside these are destroyed.
llm_translation: As it is stated: "Utterly destroy all that is in it, and its cattle, by the edge of the sword" (Joshua 6:21). From here they said: The possessions of the righteous within it perish, while the possessions of the wicked, whether within it or outside it, are spared.

hebrew_text: שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וְאֶת כׇּל שְׁלָלָהּ תִּקְבֹּץ אֶל תּוֹךְ רְחֹבָהּ וְגוֹ' אִם אֵין לָהּ רְחוֹב  עוֹשִׂין לָהּ רְחוֹב הָיְתָה רְחֹבָהּ חוּצָה לָהּ  כּוֹנְסִין אוֹתָהּ לְתוֹכָהּ
human_translation: It is stated: “And you shall gather all of its spoils into the midst of its square” If has no square, one creates a square for If there was a square outside of they bring it inside
llm_translation: As it is stated: "And all her spoil you shall gather into the midst of its open square, etc." If it does not have an open square, they make one for it. If its open square is outside, they gather it into its midst.

hebrew_text: שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וְשָׂרַפְתָּ בָאֵשׁ אֶת הָעִיר וְאֶת כׇּל שְׁלָלָהּ כָּלִיל לַה' אֱלֹהֶיךָ שְׁלָלָהּ  וְלֹא שְׁלַל שָׁמַיִם מִכָּאן אָמְרוּ הַהֶקְדֵּשׁוֹת שֶׁבָּהּ  יִפָּדוּ וּתְרוּמוֹת  יֵרָקְבוּ מַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי וְכִתְבֵי הַקֹּדֶשׁ  יִגָּנְזוּ
human_translation: It is stated “And you shall burn it with fire, both the city and all its spoils, entirely for the Lord your God.” “Its spoils,” but not the spoils of Heaven. From here stated: The consecrated in it, must be redeemed, and terumot they must decay. second tithe and sacred scrolls must be interred.
llm_translation: As it is stated: "And you shall burn the city with fire, and all its spoil, completely for the Lord your God; it shall be a heap forever, it shall not be built again" (Deuteronomy 13:17). From here, the consecrated items within it shall be redeemed, and the contributions shall decay, the second tithe shall be forgotten, and the holy scriptures shall be hidden.

hebrew_text: כָּלִיל לַה' אֱלֹהֶיךָ אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אָמַר הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא אִם אַתֶּם עוֹשִׂין דִּין בְּעִיר הַנִּדַּחַת  מַעֲלֶה אֲנִי עֲלֵיכֶם כְּאִילּוּ אַתֶּם מַעֲלִים עוֹלָה כָּלִיל לְפָנַי
human_translation: “Entirely [ kalil ] for the Lord your God,” Rabbi Shimon says: The Holy One, Blessed be He, says: If you implement judgment on an idolatrous city, I ascribe you as though you have sacrificed an entirely [ kalil ] burnt offering before Me.
llm_translation: Complete to the Lord your God, said Rabbi Shimon said the Holy One, blessed be He, if you perform judgment in a city of refuge, I credit you as if you offer a burnt offering before Me.

hebrew_text: וְהָיְתָה תֵּל עוֹלָם לֹא תֵּעָשֶׂה גַּנּוֹת וּפַרְדֵּסִים דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר לֹא תִּבָּנֶה עוֹד לִכְמוֹת שֶׁהָיְתָה אֵינָהּ נִבְנֵית אֲבָל נַעֲשֵׂית הִיא גַּנּוֹת וּפַרְדֵּסִים וְלֹא יִדְבַּק בְּיָדְךָ מְאוּמָה מִן הַחֵרֶם  שֶׁכׇּל זְמַן שֶׁהָרְשָׁעִים בָּעוֹלָם  חֲרוֹן אַף בָּעוֹלָם אָבְדוּ רְשָׁעִים מִן הָעוֹלָם  נִסְתַּלֵּק חֲרוֹן אַף מִן הָעוֹלָם
human_translation: “And it shall be a heap forever” shall not be converted gardens and orchards; the statement of Rabbi Yosei HaGelili. Rabbi Akiva says: “It shall not be built again,” to the way it was it not built; but it may be converted into gardens and orchards. “And there shall cleave nothing of that which was devoted to your hand” as long as the wicked in the world, wrath in the world; the wicked are eliminated from the world, wrath leaves the world.
llm_translation: "And it shall be a perpetual desolation; it shall not be built. Gardens and orchards shall not be made." These are the words of Rabbi Yosei the Galilean. Rabbi Akiva says, "It shall not be built again as it once was, but it shall be made into gardens and orchards, and not a penny shall stick in your hand from the ban. For as long as the wicked are in the world, the wrath of anger is upon the world. The wicked have perished from the world, and the wrath of anger has also departed from the world."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ' תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן 'יָצְאוּ'  הֵן וְלֹא שְׁלוּחִין 'אֲנָשִׁים'  אֵין אֲנָשִׁים פָּחוֹת מִשְּׁנַיִם דָּבָר אַחֵר 'אֲנָשִׁים' וְלֹא נָשִׁים 'אֲנָשִׁים'  וְלֹא קְטַנִּים
human_translation: The Sages taught “are gone out” they, but not agents “men” men no less than two. Alternatively, Men, but not women; men, but not children.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: "They went out," they themselves and not messengers. "Men" - not less than two men. Another explanation: "Men" - not women, "men" - not children.

hebrew_text: 'בְּנֵי בְּלִיַּעַל'  בָּנִים שֶׁפָּרְקוּ עוֹל שָׁמַיִם מִצַּוְּארֵיהֶם 'מִקִּרְבֶּךָ'  וְלֹא מִן הַסְּפָר 'יֹשְׁבֵי עִירָם'  וְלֹא יוֹשְׁבֵי עִיר אַחֶרֶת 'לֵאמֹר'  שֶׁצְּרִיכִין עֵדִים וְהַתְרָאָה לְכׇל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד
human_translation: “wicked persons [ benei veliyya’al ]” Sons who have cast off the yoke of Heaven from their necks. “from your midst” but not on the border. “inhabitants of their city” But not inhabitants of another city. “saying” that one requires witnesses and forewarning for each and every one
llm_translation: Sons of Belial, sons who tore off yoke from heaven from their necks, "from your midst" and not from the book "inhabitants of Ir-Am" and not inhabitants of another city, saying that witnesses and warning are required for each and every one.

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר חוֹלְקִין עִיר אַחַת לִשְׁנֵי שְׁבָטִים וְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר אֵין חוֹלְקִין עִיר אַחַת לִשְׁנֵי שְׁבָטִים אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן לְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ עַד שֶׁיְּהוּ מַדִּיחֶיהָ מֵאוֹתָהּ הָעִיר וּמֵאוֹתוֹ שֵׁבֶט מַאי לָאו אַף עַל גַּב דְּמַדִּיחֶיהָ מֵאוֹתָהּ הָעִיר אִי אִיכָּא מֵאוֹתוֹ שֵׁבֶט  אִין אִי לָא  לָא שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ חוֹלְקִין עִיר אַחַת לִשְׁנֵי שְׁבָטִים
human_translation: It was stated Rabbi Yoḥanan says: One divides one city into two tribes; and Reish Lakish says: One does not divide one city into two tribes. Rabbi Yoḥanan raised an objection to Reish Lakish Unless its subverters are from that city and from that tribe; what, is it not that although its subverters are from that city, if they are from that tribe, yes, if not, no, Conclude from it: One divides one city into two tribes,
llm_translation: It was stated: Rabbi Yochanan said, "They divide one city between two tribes." And Reish Lakish said, "They do not divide one city between two tribes." Rabbi Yochanan raised an objection to Reish Lakish: "Until they are causing it to be diminished from that city and from that tribe, what is the reason that they do not divide it? Even though they are causing it to be diminished from that city, if there is another tribe, is it not so?" No, it is not so. From there, one can infer that they divide one city between two tribes.

hebrew_text: לָא דִּנְפַלָה לֵיהּ בִּירוּשָׁה אִי נָמֵי דְּיַהֲבוּהָ נִיהֲלֵיהּ בְּמַתָּנָה
human_translation: No, where fell to him as an inheritance Alternatively, where they gave him as a gift.
llm_translation: Not judged for him in inheritance if true that they gave it to him as a gift.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ עָרִים תֵּשַׁע מֵאֵת שְׁנֵי הַשְּׁבָטִים הָאֵלֶּה מַאי לָאו אַרְבַּע וּפַלְגָא מֵהַאי וְאַרְבַּע וּפַלְגָא מֵהַאי וּשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ חוֹלְקִין עִיר אַחַת לִשְׁנֵי שְׁבָטִים לָא אַרְבַּע מֵהַאי וְחָמֵשׁ מֵהַאי
human_translation: raised an objection to “Nine cities from those two tribes” What, is it not four-and-a-half from this and four-and-a-half from that and conclude from it one divides one city into two tribes? No, Four from this and five from that
llm_translation: He raised an objection against him: "Cities nine from these two tribes, what is it not four and a half from this, and four and a half from this? And learn from it: they divide one city between two tribes, not four from this, and five from this."

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי לִפְרוֹשׁ פָּרוֹשֵׁי
human_translation: If so, let state explicitly
llm_translation: If so, to explain the explanations.

hebrew_text: קַשְׁיָא
human_translation: a difficulty
llm_translation: The Talmudic text "קַשְׁיָא" can be translated into English as "difficulty" or "challenge."

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ הוּדְּחוּ מֵאֲלֵיהֶן מַהוּ וַיַּדִּיחוּ אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא וְלֹא שֶׁהוּדְּחוּ מֵאֲלֵיהֶן אוֹ דִילְמָא אֲפִילּוּ הוּדְּחוּ מֵאֲלֵיהֶן
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before subverted themselves what is the Merciful One states: “And have subverted,” But not if they subvert themselves; or perhaps even they subverted themselves
llm_translation: The question was asked to them: If they were pushed away from them, what is the law? And they were pushed away. The Merciful One said, "And not that they were pushed away from them," or perhaps even if they were pushed away from them.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע הִדִּיחוּהָ נָשִׁים וּקְטַנִּים אַמַּאי לֶיהֱוֵי כְּהוּדְּחוּ מֵאֲלֵיהֶן  הָנָךְ בָּתַר נַפְשַׁיְיהוּ גְּרִידִי הָנֵי בָּתַר נָשִׁים וּקְטַנִּים גְּרִידִי
human_translation: Come hear women or children subvert Why Let be as they subverted themselves. these, are drawn after their own Those, are drawn after women and children
llm_translation: Come and hear: Women and children distracted her. Why should they be considered as if they have pushed her away? There, after my soul, they are a hindrance; here, after women and children, they are a hindrance.

hebrew_text: עַד שֶׁיּוּדַח רוּבָּהּ הֵיכִי עָבְדִינַן אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה דָּנִין וְחוֹבְשִׁין דָּנִין וְחוֹבְשִׁין אֲמַר לֵיהּ עוּלָּא נִמְצָא אַתָּה מְעַנֶּה אֶת דִּינָן שֶׁל אֵלּוּ אֶלָּא אָמַר עוּלָּא דָּנִין וְסוֹקְלִין דָּנִין וְסוֹקְלִין
human_translation: unless most of are subverted. How do we act Rav Yehuda says: judges and imprisons judges and imprisons Ulla said to him: result in you delaying justice for those Rather, Ulla says: judges and stones judges and stones
llm_translation: Until her majority, how do we deal with her? Rav Yehudah said: We judge and bind, we judge and bind. Ula said to him: Are you finding fault with our judgment? Rather, Ula said: We judge and stone, we judge and stone.

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר דָּנִין וְסוֹקְלִין דָּנִין וְסוֹקְלִין וְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר מַרְבִּין לָהֶן בָּתֵּי דִינִין
human_translation: It was stated Rabbi Yoḥanan says: judges and stones judges and stones And Reish Lakish says: One increases courts for them
llm_translation: It was stated: Rabbi Yochanan said, "We judge and we stone; we judge and we stone." And Reish Lakish said, "We increase the number of their courts."

hebrew_text: אִינִי וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי חָמָא בַּר יוֹסֵי אָמַר רַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא וְהוֹצֵאתָ אֶת הָאִישׁ הַהוּא אוֹ אֶת הָאִשָּׁה הָהִיא אִישׁ וְאִשָּׁה אַתָּה מוֹצִיא לִשְׁעָרֶיךָ וְאִי אַתָּה מוֹצִיא כָּל הָעִיר כּוּלָּהּ לִשְׁעָרֶיךָ אֶלָּא מַרְבִּין לָהֶן בָּתֵּי דִינִין וּמְעַיְּינִין בְּדִינֵיהֶן וּמַסְּקִינַן לְהוּ לְבֵית דִּין הַגָּדוֹל וְגָמְרִי לְהוּ לְדִינַיְיהוּ וְקָטְלִי לְהוּ
human_translation: Is that so? But doesn’t Rabbi Ḥama bar Yosei say Rabbi Oshaya says “And you shall take that man or that woman out… You take a man and a woman out to your gates but you do not take the entire city out to your gates; Rather, one increases courts for them and analyze their cases, we take them to the High Court [Sanhedrin] and issues verdict of and executes them.
llm_translation: I am not convinced, but didn't Rabbi Ḥama son of Yosei say in the name of Rabbi Oshaya, "And you shall bring out that man or that woman, the man and the woman you shall bring out to your gates. And if you do not bring out the entire city to your gates, rather, they appoint for them judges and inquire into their cases, and they bring them to the Great Court, and they conclude their cases, and they execute them."

hebrew_text: הַכֵּה תַכֶּה אֶת יֹשְׁבֵי הָעִיר וְכוּ' תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן הַחַמֶּרֶת וְהַגַּמֶּלֶת הָעוֹבֶרֶת מִמָּקוֹם לְמָקוֹם לָנוּ בְּתוֹכָהּ וְהוּדְּחוּ עִמָּהּ אִם נִשְׁתַּהוּ שָׁם שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם  הֵן בְּסַיִיף וּמָמוֹנָן אָבֵד פָּחוֹת מִיכָּן  הֵן בִּסְקִילָה וּמָמוֹנָן פָּלֵט
human_translation: “You shall smite the inhabitants of that city The Sages taught The caravan of donkeys and the caravan of camels that move from place to place, lodged in and were subverted with it, if they had stayed there thirty days they by the sword and their property is destroyed. less than that, they by stoning, and their property is spared.
llm_translation: Strike, you shall strike the inhabitants of the city, etc. The Rabbis taught: The she-ass and the she-camel that pass from place to place among us, and they are driven away with it, if they stayed there for thirty days, behold, with a sword, and their money is lost less than that, behold, with stoning, and their money is saved.

hebrew_text: וּרְמִינְהִי כַּמָּה יִהְיֶה בָּעִיר וְיִהְיֶה כְּאַנְשֵׁי הָעִיר  שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ אָמַר רָבָא לָא קַשְׁיָא הָא  לְמִיהְוֵי מִבְּנֵי מָתָא הָא לְמִיהְוֵי מִיָּתְבֵי מָתָא
human_translation: And raises a contradiction How long shall be in the city and will be like the residents of the city twelve months, Rava says: not difficult, This to become of the citizens of the city; this to become of the inhabitants of the city.
llm_translation: And ask how many will be in the city and will be like the people of the city, twelve months. Rava said: It is not difficult. This one is from the residents of the city, and this one is from the sitting of the city.

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא הַמּוּדָּר הֲנָאָה מִבְּנֵי הָעִיר אִם יֵשׁ אָדָם שֶׁנִּשְׁתַּהָא שָׁם שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ  אָסוּר לֵיהָנוֹת מִמֶּנּוּ פָּחוֹת מִיכָּן  מוּתָּר לֵיהָנוֹת מִמֶּנּוּ בְּיוֹשְׁבֵי הָעִיר אִם נִשְׁתַּהָא שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם  אָסוּר לֵיהָנוֹת מִמֶּנּוּ פָּחוֹת מִיכָּן  מוּתָּר לֵיהָנוֹת מִמֶּנּוּ
human_translation: And it is taught one prohibited by a vow from deriving benefit from the citizens of the city, if there is a person who had stayed there twelve months, it is prohibited to derive benefit from him. less than that, it is permitted to derive benefit from him. from the inhabitants of the city, if had stayed there thirty days, it is prohibited to derive benefit from him. less than that, it is permitted to derive benefit from him.
llm_translation: And it was taught: One who is designated for pleasure from the residents of the city, if a person was there for twelve months, it is forbidden to derive benefit from him; less than that, it is permitted to derive benefit from him. For the inhabitants of the city, if he was there for thirty days, it is forbidden to derive benefit from him; less than that, it is permitted to derive benefit from him.

hebrew_text: הַחֲרֵם אֹתָהּ וְאֶת כׇּל אֲשֶׁר בָּהּ כּוּ' תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן 'הַחֲרֵם אוֹתָהּ וְאֶת כׇּל אֲשֶׁר בָּהּ' פְּרָט לְנִכְסֵי צַדִּיקִים שֶׁבְּחוּצָה לָהּ 'וְאֶת כׇּל אֲשֶׁר בָּהּ'  לְרַבּוֹת נִכְסֵי צַדִּיקִים שֶׁבְּתוֹכָהּ 'שְׁלָלָהּ' וְלֹא שְׁלַל שָׁמַיִם 'וְאֶת כׇּל שְׁלָלָהּ' לְרַבּוֹת נִכְסֵי רְשָׁעִים שֶׁחוּצָה לָהּ
human_translation: “Destroy it utterly, and all that is in it” The Sages taught “Destroy it utterly, and all that is in it”; to exclude the property of the righteous that is outside “And all that is in it”; to include the property of the righteous that is inside “its spoils” But not the spoils of Heaven; “and all of its spoils” to include the property of the wicked that is outside
llm_translation: The Sages taught: "Devote it and all that is in it to destruction." This serves to exclude the property of righteous individuals that is outside of it. "And all that is in it" - to include the property of righteous individuals that is within it. "Its spoil" - not the spoil of heaven. "And all its spoil" - to include the property of wicked individuals that is outside of it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן מִפְּנֵי מָה אָמְרָה תּוֹרָה נִכְסֵי צַדִּיקִים שֶׁבְּתוֹכָהּ יֹאבֵדוּ מִי גָּרַם לָהֶם שֶׁיָּדוּרוּ בְּתוֹכָהּ  מָמוֹנָם לְפִיכָךְ מָמוֹנָם אָבֵד אָמַר מָר 'וְאֶת כׇּל שְׁלָלָהּ תִּקְבֹּץ' לְרַבּוֹת נִכְסֵי רְשָׁעִים שֶׁבְּחוּצָה לָהּ אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא וּבְנִקְבָּצִים לְתוֹכָהּ
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon said: For what does the Torah say the property of the righteous that is in it shall be destroyed? Who caused to live in their property therefore, their property is destroyed. The Master said “and you shall gather all of its spoils” to include the property of the wicked that is outside Rav Ḥisda says: And with regard to gathered into
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon said: "For what reason did the Torah say that the possessions of righteous individuals within it will be lost? Who caused them to dwell within it? Their money, therefore, was lost. Mar said: 'And all its spoils you shall gather' - to include the possessions of wicked individuals outside of it." Rav Hisda said: "And in its gatherings within it."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא פִּקְדוֹנוֹת שֶׁל אַנְשֵׁי עִיר הַנִּדַּחַת מוּתָּרִין הֵיכִי דָמֵי אִי לֵימָא דְּעִיר אַחֶרֶת וְאִיתַנְהוּ בְּגַוַּהּ  פְּשִׁיטָא דְּמוּתָּרִין לָאו שְׁלָלָהּ הוּא וְאֶלָּא דִּידְהוּ וְאִיתַנְהוּ בְּעִיר אַחֶרֶת אִי דְּנִקְבָּצִין לְתוֹכָהּ  אַמַּאי מוּתָּרִין וְאִי אֵין נִקְבָּצִין לְתוֹכָהּ  הָא אַמְרַהּ חֲדָא זִימְנָא
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda says: Deposits of the inhabitants of an idolatrous city are permitted, What are the circumstances? If we say of another city and is within obvious that permitted, not “its spoils”; But rather, belonging to and is within another city. if that gathered into why are permitted? And if cannot gathered into didn’t say once
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: The deposits of the people of a city that has been excommunicated are permitted. How so? If you say it is referring to another city, and they brought them in secretly, it is obvious that they are permitted, as it is not considered plundering. Rather, if they themselves brought them into another city, if they gather within it, why are they permitted? And if they do not gather within it, why are they permitted? This is what she said once.

hebrew_text: לָא לְעוֹלָם דְּעִיר אַחֶרֶת דְּמַפְקְדִי בְּתוֹכָהּ וְהָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן  כְּגוֹן דְּקַבֵּיל עֲלֵיהּ אַחְרָיוּת מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא כֵּיוָן דְּקַבֵּיל עֲלֵיהּ אַחְרָיוּת  כְּדִידֵיהּ דָּמֵי קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן
human_translation: No, actually of another city that is deposited within and what are we dealing with here? where assumes responsibility for Lest you say: Once he assumes responsibility for like his own teaches us
llm_translation: Not always another city that he appoints within it, and here with what are we dealing? For example, that he received upon it responsibility. What is the reason? Lest you say, since he received upon it responsibility, it is as if it were his own.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא בְּהֵמָה חֶצְיָהּ שֶׁל עִיר הַנִּדַּחַת וְחֶצְיָהּ שֶׁל עִיר אַחֶרֶת  אֲסוּרָה עִיסָּה חֶצְיָהּ שֶׁל עִיר הַנִּדַּחַת וְחֶצְיָהּ שֶׁל עִיר אַחֶרֶת  מוּתֶּרֶת מַאי טַעְמָא בְּהֵמָה כְּמַאן דְּלָא פְּלִיגָא דָּמְיָא  עִיסָּה כְּמַאן דִּפְלִיגָא דָּמְיָא
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda says: An animal half of an idolatrous city and half of another city forbidden. dough half of an idolatrous city and half of another city, permitted. What is the reason An animal is like an entity that is not divided, Dough is like an entity that is divided.
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: With regard to an animal, half of which belongs to a city of the banished and half to another city, it is prohibited. If its dough is half from the city of the banished and half from another city, it is permitted. What is the reason? With regard to an animal, it is like one in which the blood is not separated, and with regard to dough, it is like one in which the blood is separated.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רַב חִסְדָּא בֶּהֱמַת עִיר הַנִּדַּחַת מַהוּ דְּתִיתְהֲנֵי בַּהּ שְׁחִיטָה לְטַהֲרָהּ מִידֵי נְבֵילָה לְפִי חֶרֶב אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא  לָא שְׁנָא שַׁחֲטַהּ מִשְׁחָט לָא שְׁנָא קַטְלַהּ מִקְטָל אוֹ דִלְמָא כֵּיוָן דְּשַׁחְטַהּ מַהְנְיָא לַהּ שְׁחִיטָה מַאי תֵּיקוּ
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda raises a dilemma: the animal of an idolatrous city, what is is ritual slaughter effective in purifying it from of an unslaughtered animal carcass? the Merciful One states: with the edge of the sword,” it is no different one ritually slaughtered it is no different one killed Or perhaps, since one ritually slaughtered ritual slaughter is effective. What shall stand
llm_translation: The question of Rav Chisda: regarding the case of the lost animal of the city, what is the law concerning slaughtering it to purify it from the status of a carcass? Does the Merciful One differentiate between its slaughter and the slaughter of a carcass, or perhaps since he slaughtered it, the act of slaughter is effective for it? What is the resolution?

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רַב יוֹסֵף שְׂיעַר נָשִׁים צִדְקָנִיּוֹת מַהוּ אָמַר רָבָא הָא דִּרְשָׁעִיּוֹת אָסוּר תִּקְבֹּץ וְשָׂרַפְתָּ כְּתִיב מִי שֶׁאֵינוֹ מְחוּסָּר אֶלָּא קְבִיצָה וּשְׂרֵיפָה יָצָא זֶה שֶׁמְחוּסָּר תְּלִישָׁה וּקְבִיצָה וּשְׂרֵיפָה
human_translation: Rav Yosef raises a dilemma: What is the hair of pious women Rava says: that the hair of wicked forbidden “And you shall gather…and you shall burn” is written, that is lacking, only gathering and burning excluding this which is lacking detaching, gathering, and burning.
llm_translation: Inquired Rav Yosef: "Hair of righteous women, what is the law?" Rava said: "Regarding wicked women, gathering is prohibited, and you shall burn." It is written, "One who lacks only gathering and burning, he has fulfilled the requirement of threshing, gathering, and burning."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא בְּפֵיאָה נׇכְרִית הֵיכִי דָמֵי אִי דִּמְחוּבָּר בְּגוּפַהּ  כְּגוּפַהּ דָּמְיָא לָא צְרִיכָא דִּתְלֵי בְּסִיבְטָא כְּנִכְסֵי צַדִּיקִים שֶׁבְּתוֹכָהּ דָּמֵי  וְאָבַד אוֹ דִלְמָא כֵּיוָן דְּעָיְילָא וְנָפְקָא כִּלְבוּשַׁהּ דָּמֵי תֵּיקוּ
human_translation: Rather, Rava says: with regard to a wig. What are the circumstances? If is attached to her body, like her body. No, is necessary where is hanging on a peg. Is like the property of the righteous inside and it is destroyed, or perhaps, since she enters and exits like a garment, shall stand
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said: In the case of a foreign coin in a corner, how is it valued? If it is connected in its body, its value is like its body. It is not necessary for it to depend on the market, like the possessions of righteous individuals within it. Perhaps it will be lost, or maybe since it entered and came out with its garment, its value is established. That is satisfactory.

hebrew_text: וְאֶת כׇּל שְׁלָלָהּ תִּקְבֹּץ אֶל תּוֹךְ רְחֹבָהּ וְכוּ' תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן אֵין לָהּ רְחוֹב  אֵינָהּ נַעֲשֵׂית עִיר הַנִּדַּחַת דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר אֵין לָהּ רְחוֹב  עוֹשִׂין לָהּ רְחוֹב בְּמַאי קָמִיפַּלְגִי מָר סָבַר רְחוֹבָהּ  מֵעִיקָּרָא מַשְׁמַע וּמָר סָבַר רְחוֹבָהּ  הַשְׁתָּא נָמֵי מַשְׁמַע
human_translation: “And you shall gather all of its spoils into the midst of its square” the Sages taught: has no square, it does not become an idolatrous city, the statement of Rabbi Yishmael. Rabbi Akiva says: has no square, one creates a square for With regard to what do they disagree? Sage, holds “its square” indicates from the outset. And Sage, holds “its square” also indicate now.
llm_translation: And all its spoils gather to the midst of its open square, and so it was taught: The sages said, if it does not have a square, it does not become a city of refuge - these are the words of Rabbi Yishmael. Rabbi Akiva says, if it does not have a square, they make a square for it. With what do they make a square for it? Mar Sabar thought its square from the beginning, and Mar Sabar thought its square now also.

hebrew_text: וְהַהֶקְדֵּשׁוֹת שֶׁבָּהּ יִפָּדוּ כּוּ' תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן הָיוּ בָּהּ קׇדְשֵׁי קֳדָשִׁים קׇדְשֵׁי מִזְבֵּחַ יָמוּתוּ קׇדְשֵׁי בֶּדֶק הַבַּיִת יִפָּדוּ וּתְרוּמוֹת יֵרָקְבוּ וּמַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי וְכִתְבֵי הַקֹּדֶשׁ יִגָּנְזוּ רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר 'בְּהֶמְתָּהּ' וְלֹא בֶּהֱמַת בְּכוֹר וּמַעֲשֵׂר 'שְׁלָלָהּ' פְּרָט לְכֶסֶף הֶקְדֵּשׁ וְכֶסֶף מַעֲשֵׂר
human_translation: And the consecrated in it must be redeemed. The Sages taught If there were offerings of the most sacred order in it, consecrated for the altar, they shall die; consecrated for Temple maintenance must be redeemed, and terumot must decay, and second tithe and sacred scrolls must be interred. Rabbi Shimon says: “Its animals” exclude a firstborn animal and tithe, “Its spoils” exclude consecrated money and tithe money.
llm_translation: The consecrated items within it shall be redeemed. The Rabbis taught: If there were within it holy of holies, they shall be redeemed; holy items of the altar shall be destroyed; holy items of the Temple courtyard shall be redeemed; and tithes shall rot; second tithes and holy writings shall be hidden. Rabbi Shimon says: "Its animal" excludes a firstborn animal and tithe; "its spoil" excludes consecrated money and tithe.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר הָיוּ בָּהּ קׇדְשֵׁי קֳדָשִׁים קׇדְשֵׁי מִזְבֵּחַ יָמוּתוּ וְאַמַּאי יָמוּתוּ יִרְעוּ עַד שֶׁיִּסְתָּאֲבוּ וְיִמָּכְרוּ וְיִפְּלוּ דְּמֵיהֶן לִנְדָבָה
human_translation: The Master said: If there were offerings of the most sacred order in it, consecrated for the altar, they shall die. But why shall they die? They should graze until they become unfit, and they should be sold and their value should be allocated for gift
llm_translation: Master said: If holy of holies, holy of altar were in it, they shall die. And why shall they die? They shall graze until they fatten, and be sold, and their money shall be for donation.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר זֶבַח רְשָׁעִים תּוֹעֵבָה רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר מָמוֹן בְּעָלִים הוּא וְהָכָא בְּקָדָשִׁים שֶׁחַיָּיב בְּאַחְרָיוּתָן וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן הִיא דְּאָמַר מָמוֹן בְּעָלִים הוּא
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: “The offering of the wicked is an abomination” Reish Lakish says: is the property of its owner And here, to offerings which one bears responsibility for their And is Rabbi Shimon, who says: is the property of owner.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: "The sacrifice of the wicked is an abomination." Reish Lakish said: "It is the money of the owners." And here in regards to holy things, one is liable for their consequences. And Rabbi Shimon Ha'hiya said: "It is the money of the owners."

hebrew_text: הָא מִדְּסֵיפָא רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן הִיא רֵישָׁא לָאו רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בְּקָדָשִׁים קַלִּים וְאַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי דְּאָמַר קָדָשִׁים קַלִּים מָמוֹן בְּעָלִים אֲבָל קׇדְשֵׁי קָדָשִׁים מַאי  יִפָּדוּ
human_translation: From that the latter clause is Rabbi Shimon, the first clause is not Rabbi Shimon. offerings of lesser sanctity, and in accordance with of Rabbi Yosei HaGelili, who says: Offerings of lesser sanctity are the property of owner. But offerings of the most sacred order, what They shall be redeemed.
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: Rabbi Shimon, is the beginning not Rabbi Shimon in Kodshim? According to the opinion of Rabbi Yosei the Galilean who says, "Kodshim Kalim are redeemed with money by the owners, but what is the law regarding Kodshai Kodashim - how are they redeemed?"

hebrew_text: אַדְּתָנֵי סֵיפָא קׇדְשֵׁי בֶּדֶק הַבַּיִת יִפָּדוּ לִיפְלוֹג וְלִיתְנֵי בְּדִידַהּ בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים  בְּקָדָשִׁים קַלִּים אֲבָל קׇדְשֵׁי קָדָשִׁים  יִפָּדוּ כֵּיוָן דְּאִיכָּא חַטָּאת שֶׁמֵּתוּ בְּעָלֶיהָ דִּלְמִיתָה אָזְלָא לָא פְּסִיקָא לֵיהּ
