human_translation: rather than teaching the latter clause consecrated for Temple maintenance must be redeemed, let distinguish and teach within itself, In what is this statement, said? with regard to offerings of lesser sanctity; but with regard to offerings of the most sacred order, they shall be redeemed. Since there is a sin-offering whose owners have died, which is left to die, is not clear-cut for
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: In the case of the consecrated animals of the Temple courtyard, they should be redeemed to be divided, and their value should be used for their own purpose. In what circumstances are these matters said? In the case of light holy items, but the most holy items should be redeemed, for if there is a sin-offering whose owner has died, perhaps its redemption will not be interrupted.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן לָא אָמַר כְּרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ דִּכְתִיב זֶבַח רְשָׁעִים תּוֹעֵבָה אֶלָּא רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ מַאי טַעְמָא לָא אָמַר כְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר לָךְ כִּי אָמְרִינַן זֶבַח רְשָׁעִים תּוֹעֵבָה  הָנֵי מִילֵּי הֵיכָא דְּאִיתַנְהוּ בְּעֵינַיְיהוּ אֲבָל הָכָא כֵּיוָן דְּאִישְׁתַּנִּי אִישְׁתַּנִּי
human_translation: Granted, Rabbi Yoḥanan does not say in accordance with Reish Lakish, that it is written: “The offering of the wicked is an abomination,” But Reish Lakish, what is the reason he does not say in accordance with Rabbi Yoḥanan? said to you when we say: “The offering of the wicked is an abomination,” this statement where is in its unadulterated form. But here, since it changed it changed,
llm_translation: In truth, Rabbi Yochanan did not say like Reish Lakish, as it is written, "The sacrifice of the wicked is an abomination." Rather, Reish Lakish, what is the reason? He did not say like Rabbi Yochanan. He said to you, "For we say, 'The sacrifice of the wicked is an abomination,' those matters where they are pleasing in their eyes. But here, since it has changed, it has changed."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר 'בְּהֶמְתָּהּ'  וְלֹא בֶּהֱמַת בְּכוֹר וּמַעֲשֵׂר בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן אִילֵימָא בִּתְמִימִין שְׁלַל שָׁמַיִם הוּא אֶלָּא בְּבַעֲלֵי מוּמִין שְׁלָלָהּ נִינְהוּ
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says “its animals” exclude a firstborn animal and tithe. What are we dealing with? If we say with regard to unblemished animals, they are the spoils of Heaven Rather, with regard to blemished they are the spoils of
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says, "With her animal," and not with the firstborn animal, and regarding tithes, what are we dealing with? If you say with unblemished animals, it is the spoils of heaven, rather it is with blemished animals that its spoils they are.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבִינָא לְעוֹלָם בְּבַעֲלֵי מוּמִין וּמִי שֶׁנֶּאֱכָל בְּתוֹרַת בְּהֶמְתָּהּ יָצְאוּ אֵלּוּ שֶׁאֵין נֶאֱכָלִין בְּתוֹרַת בְּהֶמְתָּהּ אֶלָּא בְּתוֹרַת בְּכוֹר וּמַעֲשֵׂר דִּשְׁלַל שָׁמַיִם נִינְהוּ
human_translation: Ravina says: Actually, with regard to blemished and which is eaten as its animals, Excluded are those which, are not eaten as its animals; rather, as firstborn and tithe are the spoils of Heaven.
llm_translation: Ravina said: Always with blemishes and one who has been consumed in the Torah of its animal, they have fulfilled; these are those that are not consumed in the Torah of its animal except in the Torah of the firstborn and the tithe of the spoils of heaven.

hebrew_text: וּפְלִיגָא דִּשְׁמוּאֵל דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל הַכֹּל קָרֵב וְהַכֹּל נִפְדֶּה מַאי קָאָמַר הָכִי קָאָמַר כׇּל שֶׁקָּרֵב כְּשֶׁהוּא תָּם וְנִפְדֶּה כְּשֶׁהוּא בַּעַל מוּם מִ'שְּׁלָלָהּ' אִימְּעִיט וְכׇל שֶׁקָּרֵב כְּשֶׁהוּא תָּם וְאֵינוֹ נִפְדָּה כְּשֶׁהוּא בַּעַל מוּם כְּגוֹן בְּכוֹר וּמַעֲשֵׂר מִ'בְּהֶמְתָּהּ' נָפְקָא
human_translation: And disputes of Shmuel, as Shmuel says: Everything is sacrificed and everything is redeemed. What is he saying? this he is saying: Any that is sacrificed when it is unblemished and is redeemed when it is blemished is excluded from spoils,” And any that is sacrificed when it is unblemished and is not redeemed when it is blemished, e.g., a firstborn and tithe, is derived from animals,”
llm_translation: Disagreement of Shmuel who said: Shmuel, everything that is brought near and everything that is redeemed. What is he saying? This is what he is saying: Anyone that is brought near when he is whole and redeemed when he is blemished, from "its valuation" he shall diminish. And anyone that is brought near when he is whole and is not redeemed when he is blemished, such as a firstborn and tithe, from "its animal" it is derived.

hebrew_text: תְּרוּמוֹת יֵרָקְבוּ אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא תְּרוּמָה בְּיַד יִשְׂרָאֵל אֲבָל תְּרוּמָה בְּיַד כֹּהֵן כֵּיוָן דְּמָמוֹנֵיהּ הוּא  תִּשָּׂרֵף
human_translation: Terumot must decay. Rav Ḥisda says: taught only teruma in the possession of an Israelite, But teruma in the possession of a priest since it is his property, it shall be burned.
llm_translation: Trumot will rot. Rav Chisda said: They only taught regarding a terumah in the hand of Israel, but a terumah in the hand of a kohen, since it is his money, it shall be burned.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַב יוֹסֵף מַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי וְכִתְבֵי הַקֹּדֶשׁ יִגָּנְזוּ וְהָא מַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי בְּיַד יִשְׂרָאֵל כִּתְרוּמָה בְּיַד כֹּהֵן דָּמֵי וְקָתָנֵי יִגָּנְזוּ אֶלָּא אִי אִתְּמַר הָכִי אִתְּמַר אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא תְּרוּמָה בְּיַד כֹּהֵן אֲבָל תְּרוּמָה בְּיַד יִשְׂרָאֵל  תִּנָּתֵן לְכֹהֵן שֶׁבְּעִיר אַחֶרֶת
human_translation: Rav Yosef raises an objection Second tithe and sacred scrolls must be interred. But isn’t second tithe in the possession of an Israelite like teruma in the possession of a priest, and it is taught: must be interred? Rather, if was stated, this is what was stated: Rav Ḥisda says: taught only teruma in the possession of a priest But teruma in the possession of an Israelite, shall be given to a priest who is in another city,
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: Rav Yosef raised a contradiction. Regarding the second tithe and the holy writings, they should be hidden away. But the second tithe is in the possession of Israelites like terumah, and in the possession of a kohen, its value. And it was taught: they should be hidden away. Rather, if it was stated thus, it was stated thus: Rav Ḥisdah said: They only taught differently regarding terumah in the possession of a kohen, but regarding terumah in the possession of Israelites, it should be given to a kohen in another city.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן הָתָם עִיסָּה שֶׁל מַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי פְּטוּרָה מִן הַחַלָּה דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר וַחֲכָמִים מְחַיְּיבִין אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא מַחְלוֹקֶת בְּמַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר סָבַר מַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי מָמוֹן גָּבוֹהַּ הוּא וְרַבָּנַן סָבְרִי מָמוֹן הֶדְיוֹט הוּא אֲבָל בִּגְבוּלִין  דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל פָּטוּר
human_translation: We learned there: Second-tithe dough is exempt from ḥalla the statement of Rabbi Meir. And the Rabbis deem liable Rav Ḥisda says: dispute with regard to second tithe in Jerusalem; as Rabbi Meir holds: Second-tithe is property to the Most High, And the Rabbis hold: It is non-sacred property But in the outlying areas, everyone agrees that one is exempt
llm_translation: We learned there: Dough of the second tithe is exempt from challah. These are the words of Rabbi Meir, while the Sages obligate challah. Rav Ḥisdah said: The dispute is regarding the second tithe in Jerusalem. Rabbi Meir holds that the second tithe is considered money, and the Rabbis hold that it is considered ordinary produce. However, regarding the borders, everyone agrees that it is exempt.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַב יוֹסֵף מַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי וְכִתְבֵי הַקֹּדֶשׁ יִגָּנְזוּ בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן אִילֵימָא בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם מִי הָוְיָא עִיר הַנִּדַּחַת וְהָתַנְיָא עֲשָׂרָה דְּבָרִים נֶאֶמְרוּ בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם וְזוֹ אַחַת מֵהֶן אֵינָהּ נַעֲשֵׂית עִיר הַנִּדַּחַת וְאֶלָּא בְּעִיר אַחֶרֶת וְאַסְּקוּהּ לְגַוַּהּ הָא קַלְטוּהּ מְחִיצוֹת
human_translation: Rav Yosef raises an objection Second tithe and sacred scrolls must be interred. What are we dealing with? If we say in Jerusalem, can be an idolatrous city? But isn’t it taught Ten matters were stated with regard to Jerusalem, and this is one of them: It does not become an idolatrous city. Rather, in a different city and one took up into wasn’t admitted the walls
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: Rav Yosef raised a contradiction regarding second tithe and sacred writings being hidden away. With what are we dealing? If we say in Jerusalem, was it ever a city of refuge? But it was taught: Ten matters were stated in Jerusalem, and one of them was not fulfilled - that it should not become a city of refuge. Rather, it should be in another city, and they should enclose it with a wall.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לָאו בִּגְבוּלִין וְקָתָנֵי יִגָּנְזוּ לָא לְעוֹלָם דְּעִיר אַחֶרֶת וְאַסְּקוּהּ לְגַוַּהּ וְהָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן  שֶׁנִּטְמָא
human_translation: Rather, not in an outlying area? And it is taught: must be interred. No, actually, in a different city, and one took up into And what are we dealing with here? where became ritually impure.
llm_translation: Rather, not in the borders, and it is taught: they should be hidden, not forever, in another city, and they should take it to a valley, and here, with what are we dealing? That it became impure.

hebrew_text: וְלִפְרְקֵיהּ דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר מִנַּיִין לְמַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי שֶׁנִּטְמָא שֶׁפּוֹדִין אוֹתוֹ אֲפִילּוּ בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם  תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר לֹא תוּכַל שְׂאֵתוֹ וְאֵין שְׂאֵת אֶלָּא אֲכִילָה שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וַיִּשָּׂא מַשְׂאֹת מֵאֵת פָּנָיו  הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן בְּלָקוּחַ
human_translation: And let him redeem it as Rabbi Elazar says: From where with regard to second-tithe that became impure, that one may redeem it even in Jerusalem? the verse states: so that you are unable to carry it [ se’eto ]… And se’et nothing other than eating, as it is stated: “And he took portions [ masot ] from before him” What are we dealing with here? where purchased
llm_translation: And in his explanation, as Rabbi Elazar said, from where do we derive the obligation of a second tithe that became impure, that we redeem it even in Jerusalem? The verse teaches us, "You shall not be able to carry it," and carrying refers only to consumption, as it is stated, "And he carried the loads from before his face." Here, what are we dealing with? With purchasing.

hebrew_text: וְלִיפְרְקֵיהּ דִּתְנַן הַלָּקוּחַ בְּכֶסֶף מַעֲשֵׂר שֶׁנִּטְמָא  יִפָּדֶה כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה דְּאָמַר  יִקָּבֵר אִי הָכִי מַאי אִירְיָא עִיר הַנִּדַּחַת אֲפִילּוּ דְּעָלְמָא נָמֵי
human_translation: And let him redeem as we learned that is purchased with tithe money that became ritually impure shall be redeemed. in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda, who says: shall be buried, If so, why specifically an idolatrous city? even in general as well,
llm_translation: And to resolve it, as we learned in a Mishnah: "If produce was purchased with money of Ma'aser that became impure, it shall be redeemed according to Rabbi Yehuda who said: 'If so, what is it called? A city of refuge, even though it is in the world.'"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְעוֹלָם בְּטָהוֹר וּכְגוֹן דִּנְפוּל מְחִיצוֹת וְכִדְרָבָא דְּאָמַר רָבָא מְחִיצָה לֶאֱכוֹל דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא לִקְלוֹט דְּרַבָּנַן וְכִי גְּזוּר רַבָּנַן כִּי אִתַנְהוּ לִמְחִיצוֹת כִּי לֵיתַנְהוּ לִמְחִיצוֹת לָא
human_translation: Rather, actually, with regard to pure and where the walls fell. And as Rava says: wall to partake by Torah law. wall to admit by rabbinic law. And where the Sages issue the decree where the wall is where the wall is not no,
llm_translation: Rather, forever in purity, and for example, if a partition falls, and like Rava who said, "A partition for eating is from the Torah to enclose, from the Rabbis." And is it a decree of the Rabbis when they gave it for partitions? When they did not give it for partitions, no.

hebrew_text: כִּתְבֵי הַקֹּדֶשׁ  יִגָּנְזוּ מַתְנִיתִין דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר דְּתַנְיָא רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר כׇּל עִיר שֶׁיֵּשׁ בָּהּ אֲפִילּוּ מְזוּזָה אַחַת  אֵינָהּ נַעֲשֵׂית עִיר הַנִּדַּחַת שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר 'וְשָׂרַפְתָּ בָאֵשׁ אֶת הָעִיר וְאֶת כׇּל שְׁלָלָהּ כָּלִיל' וְהֵיכָא דְּאִיכָּא מְזוּזָה לָא אֶפְשָׁר דִּכְתִיב לֹא תַעֲשׂוּן כֵּן לַה' אֱלֹהֵיכֶם
human_translation: Sacred scrolls must be interred. the mishna is not in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer, as it is taught Rabbi Eliezer says: Any city in which there is even one mezuza is not rendered an idolatrous city, as it is stated: “And you shall burn it with fire, both the city and all its spoils, entirely And where there is a mezuza it is not possible as it is written: “You shall not do so to the Lord your God”
llm_translation: The holy writings should be hidden, mishnayot that are not like Rabbi Eliezer, as it was taught in a baraita: Rabbi Eliezer says, "Any city that has even one mezuzah is not considered a city that is to be destroyed, as it is stated, 'And you shall burn the city and all its spoil completely.' And where there is a mezuzah, it is not possible, for it is written, 'You shall not do so to the Lord your God.'"

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר אָמַר הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא וְכוּ' לֵימָא בִּדְרַבִּי אָבִין אָמַר רַבִּי אִילְעָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אָבִין אָמַר רַבִּי אִילְעָא כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁאַתָּה מוֹצֵא כְּלָל בַּעֲשֵׂה וּפְרָט בְּלֹא תַעֲשֶׂה אֵין דָּנִין אוֹתוֹ בִּכְלָל וּפְרָט
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: The Holy One, Blessed be He, says: Let us say with regard to that Rabbi Avin says Rabbi Ile’a disagree, as Rabbi Avin says Rabbi Ile’a says: Anywhere that you find a generalization as a positive mitzva a detail as a prohibition, one does not deduce based on a generalization and a detail;
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says, the Holy One, blessed be He, said, and so forth. Let it be said in the name of Rabbi Avin: Rabbi Ile'a argued with regard to what Rabbi Avin said, that Rabbi Ile'a said, "In any place where you find a general statement followed by a specific detail, one does not include it in the general statement."

hebrew_text: דְּמָר אִית לֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי אָבִין  וּמָר לֵית לֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי אָבִין
human_translation: that Sage, is of of Rabbi Avin, and Sage, is of not of Rabbi Avin.
llm_translation: The Master has a disciple, Rabbi Avin, and the Master does not have a disciple, Rabbi Avin.

hebrew_text: לָא דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא אִית לְהוּ דְּרַבִּי אָבִין וְהָכָא בְּהָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי מָר סָבַר עוֹד לִגְמָרֵי מַשְׁמַע וּמָר סָבַר עוֹד  לִכְמָה שֶׁהָיְתָה אֵינָהּ נִבְנֵית אֲבָל נַעֲשֵׂית הִיא גַּנּוֹת וּפַרְדֵּסִים
human_translation: No, everyone is of of Rabbi Avin, and here, they disagree about this: Sage, holds “again” indicates entirely And Sage, holds “again” it is not built to as it was, but it converted into gardens and orchards.
llm_translation: Not everyone in the world has a Rabbi Avin, but here in this place, Mar Sabar thought it should still be completed, and Mar Sabar thought how much it was not built, but it was made into gardens and orchards.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן הָיוּ בָּהּ אִילָנוֹת תְּלוּשִׁין אֲסוּרִין מְחוּבָּרִין מוּתָּרִין שֶׁל עִיר אַחֶרֶת בֵּין תְּלוּשִׁין בֵּין מְחוּבָּרִין אֲסוּרִין מַאי עִיר אַחֶרֶת אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא יְרִיחוֹ דִּכְתִיב וְהָיְתָה הָעִיר חֵרֶם לַה' וַיַּשְׁבַּע יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בָּעֵת הַהִיא לֵאמֹר אָרוּר הָאִישׁ לִפְנֵי ה' אֲשֶׁר יָקוּם וּבָנָה אֶת הָעִיר הַזֹּאת אֶת יְרִיחוֹ בִּבְכֹרוֹ יְיַסְּדֶנָּה וּבִצְעִירוֹ יַצִּיב דְּלָתֶיהָ
human_translation: The Sages taught there were trees in detached forbidden attached permitted, of another city, whether detached or attached, forbidden. what Another city? Rav Ḥisda says: Jericho, as it is written: “And the city shall be devoted, to the Lord…And Joshua charged them at that time by oath, saying: Cursed be the man before the Lord, that rises up to build this city Jericho; he shall lay its foundation with his firstborn, and with his youngest son shall he set up the gates of it”
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: There were trees in it a city, detached from the ground, connected, and uprooted. Those that were detached or connected were prohibited, but those of another city were permitted, whether detached or connected. What is meant by "another city"? Rav Hisda said: Jericho, as it is written, "And the city shall be devoted, it and all that is in it, to the Lord; only Rahab the harlot shall live, she and all who are with her in the house, because she hid the messengers that we sent" (Joshua 6:17).

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא לֹא יְרִיחוֹ עַל שֵׁם עִיר אַחֶרֶת וְלֹא עִיר אַחֶרֶת עַל שֵׁם יְרִיחוֹ דִּכְתִיב 'בָּנָה חִיאֵל בֵּית הָאֱלִי אֶת יְרִיחֹה בַּאֲבִירָם בְּכֹרוֹ יִסְּדָהּ וּבִשְׂגוּב צְעִירוֹ הִצִּיב דְּלָתֶיהָ'
human_translation: It is taught not Jericho to the name of another city, and not another city name Jericho, as it is written: “Hiel the Bethelite built Jericho; with Abiram, his firstborn, he laid its foundation, and with his young son Segub set up its gates”
llm_translation: It was taught: One may not name a place after Jericho, nor Jericho after another place, as it is written, "Hiel the Bethelite built Jericho; he laid its foundation with Abiram his firstborn, and set up its gates with his youngest son Segub."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא בַּאֲבִירָם בְּכוֹרוֹ רָשָׁע לֹא הָיָה לוֹ לִלְמוֹד בִּשְׂגוּב צְעִירוֹ  הָיָה לוֹ לִלְמוֹד
human_translation: It is taught of Abiram, his firstborn, the wicked, it was not upon him to learn with Segub his young son, it was upon him to learn
llm_translation: It was taught in Aviram: His firstborn was wicked, he did not have to learn in Sgub, his younger one had to learn.

hebrew_text: אֲבִירָם וּשְׂגוּב מַאי עֲבוּד מַאי קָאָמַר הָכִי קָאָמַר בַּאֲבִירָם בְּכוֹרוֹ הָיָה לוֹ לִלְמוֹד לְאוֹתוֹ רָשָׁע בִּשְׂגוּב צְעִירוֹ מִמַּשְׁמָע שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר 'בַּאֲבִירָם בְּכוֹרוֹ' אֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ שֶׁשְּׂגוּב צְעִירוֹ מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר 'שְׂגוּב צְעִירוֹ'  מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהָיָה מְקַבֵּר וְהוֹלֵךְ מֵאֲבִירָם עַד שְׂגוּב
human_translation: What did Abiram and Segub do what is saying? this is saying: From Abiram, his firstborn, that wicked man should have learned about Segub his young By inference from that is stated: “With Abiram, his firstborn,” do I not know that Segub his young what the verse states: “His young son Segub”? teaches that he gradually buried from Abiram through Segub,
llm_translation: Aviram and Segub, what is the service? What is he saying? This is what he is saying: In Aviram, his firstborn, he had to learn that he was wicked. In Segub, his youngest, from the very name, as it is said, "In Aviram his firstborn," I do not know that Segub was his youngest. What is the teaching to say "Segub his youngest"? It teaches that he was burying and walking from Aviram to Segub.

hebrew_text: אַחְאָב שׁוֹשְׁבִינֵיהּ הֲוָה אֲתָא אִיהוּ וְאֵלִיָּהוּ לְמִשְׁאַל בִּשְׁלָמָא בֵּי טַמְיָא יָתֵיב וְקָאָמַר דִּילְמָא כִּי (מֵילָט) [לָט] יְהוֹשֻׁעַ הָכִי לָט לֹא יְרִיחוֹ עַל שֵׁם עִיר אַחֶרֶת וְלֹא עִיר אַחֶרֶת עַל שֵׁם יְרִיחוֹ אָמַר לֵיהּ אֵלִיָּהוּ אִין אֲמַר לֵיהּ הַשְׁתָּא לְווֹטְתָא דְּמֹשֶׁה לָא קָא מִקַּיְימָא דִּכְתִיב 'וְסַרְתֶּם וַעֲבַדְתֶּם' וְגוֹ' וּכְתִיב 'וְחָרָה אַף ה' בָּכֶם וְעָצַר אֶת הַשָּׁמַיִם' וְגוֹ' וְהָהוּא גַּבְרָא אוֹקֵים לֵיהּ עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה עַל כׇּל תֶּלֶם וְתֶלֶם וְלָא שָׁבֵיק לֵיהּ מִיטְרָא לְמֵיזַל מִיסְגָּד לֵיהּ לְווֹטְתָא דִּיהוֹשֻׁעַ תַּלְמִידֵיהּ מִקַּיְימָא
human_translation: Ahab was groomsman. He and Elijah came to inquire about welfare the house of mourning [ bei tamya ]. sat and said: Perhaps when Joshua cursed, this he cursed: Not Jericho to the name of another city, and not another city name Jericho. Elijah said to him: Yes, said to Now the curse of Moses is not fulfilled, as it is written: “And you go astray and worship and it is written: “Then the Lord’s anger will flare against you, and He will close the heavens, And that man, established idol worship on each and every furrow and the rain it does not allow him to go and worship it; the curse of his student, Joshua, be fulfilled?
llm_translation: Achav Shoshvinaihu havah atah Iehu veEliyahu leMish'al bishlama bei Tamya yatev veKa'amar dilma ki (meilat) lat Yehoshua hachi lat lo Yericho al shem ir acheret veLo ir acheret al shem Yericho amar lei Eliyahu ein amar lei hashata levoteta deMoshe la ka mikayma dikhtiv 'vesartem vaavadtem' veGo' ukhtiv 'vechara af Hashem bakhem ve'atzar et hashamayim' veGo' vehahu gavra okeim lei avodah zara al kol telem veTelem veLo shavik lei mitra lemeizal misgad lei levoteta deYehoshua talmedei mikayma

hebrew_text: מִיָּד וַיֹּאמֶר אֵלִיָּהוּ הַתִּשְׁבִּי מִתֹּשָׁבֵי גִלְעָד חַי ה' אֱלֹהֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל אִם יִהְיֶה טַל וּמָטָר וְגוֹ' בָּעֵי רַחֲמֵי וִ[י]הַבוּ לֵיהּ אַקְלִידָא דְּמִטְרָא וְקָם וַאֲזַל
human_translation: Immediately: “And Elijah the Tishbite, who was of the inhabitants of Gilead, said As the Lord God of Israel lives, there shall not be dew or rain prayed for mercy and they gave him the key to rainfall and he arose and went.
llm_translation: Immediately, and Elijah said, "The Tishbite, from the inhabitants of Gilead, 'As the Lord, the God of Israel lives, if there will be dew and rain, etc., seeking mercy, and they gave him a clod of rain, and he arose and went."

hebrew_text: וַיְהִי דְבַר ה' אֵלָיו לֵאמֹר לֵךְ מִזֶּה וּפָנִיתָ לְּךָ קֵדְמָה וְנִסְתַּרְתָּ בְּנַחַל כְּרִית וְהָעֹרְבִים מְבִיאִים לוֹ לֶחֶם וּבָשָׂר בַּבֹּקֶר וְגוֹ' מֵהֵיכָא אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב מִבֵּי טַבָּחֵי דְאַחְאָב וַיְהִי מִקֵּץ יָמִים וַיִּיבַשׁ הַנָּחַל כִּי לֹא הָיָה גֶשֶׁם בָּאָרֶץ כֵּיוָן דַּחֲזָא דְּאִיכָּא צַעֲרָא בְּעָלְמָא כְּתִיב וַיְהִי דְבַר ה' אֵלָיו לֵאמֹר קוּם לֵךְ צָרְפַתָה
human_translation: “And the word of the Lord came to him, saying: Go from here, and turn eastward, and hide yourself by Wadi Cherith…And the ravens brought him bread and meat in the morning” From where Rabbi Yehuda says Rav says: from the slaughterhouse of Ahab. “And it came to pass after some days, that the wadi dried up, because there was no rain in the land” Since saw that there is suffering in the world it is written: “And the word of the Lord came to him, saying: Arise, go to Zarephath”
llm_translation: And it was the word of the Lord to him saying, "Go from here and turn eastward and hide yourself by the brook Cherith, which is before the Jordan. And the ravens bring him bread and meat in the morning, etc." From where did he say this? Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav, from the houses of the butchers of Ahab. And it was after many days that the brook dried up because there was no rain in the land. Once he saw that there was distress in the world, it is written, "And the word of the Lord came to him saying, 'Arise, go to Zarephath.'"

hebrew_text: וּכְתִיב וַיְהִי אַחַר הַדְּבָרִים הָאֵלֶּה חָלָה בֶּן הָאִשָּׁה בַּעֲלַת הַבָּיִת בְּעָא רַחֲמֵי לְמִיתַּן לֵיהּ אַקְלִידָא דִּתְחִיַּית הַמֵּתִים אָמְרִי לֵיהּ שָׁלֹשׁ מַפְתְּחוֹת לֹא נִמְסְרוּ לְשָׁלִיחַ שֶׁל חַיָּה וְשֶׁל גְּשָׁמִים וְשֶׁל תְּחִיַּית הַמֵּתִים יֹאמְרוּ שְׁתַּיִם בְּיַד תַּלְמִיד וְאַחַת בְּיַד הָרַב אַיְיתִי הָא וּשְׁקֵיל הַאי דִּכְתִיב 'לֵךְ הֵרָאֵה אֶל אַחְאָב וְאֶתְּנָה מָטָר'
human_translation: And it is written: “And it came to pass after these matters, that the son of the woman, the mistress of the house, became sick” prayed for mercy, to give him the key to the resurrection of the dead. They said to him Three keys were not passed to an agent: to a woman in childbirth, to rainfall, and to the resurrection of the dead. will say: Two are in the possession of the student and one is in the possession of the Master. Bring this and take this as it is written: “Go, appear before Ahab; and I will give rain”
llm_translation: And it is written: "And it came to pass after these things, that the son of the woman, the mistress of the house, fell sick; and his sickness was so sore, that there was no breath left in him." She sought mercy to kill him. Elijah the prophet, who revives the dead, said to her: "Three keys were not entrusted to an agent: the key of rain, the key of childbirth, and the key of reviving the dead." They said: Two are in the hand of a disciple, and one in the hand of the master. She brought him, and he took the key, as it is written: "Go, show thyself unto Ahab; and I will send rain upon the earth."

hebrew_text: דְּרַשׁ הַהוּא גָּלִילָאָה קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב חִסְדָּא מָשָׁל דְּאֵלִיָּהוּ לָמָּה הַדָּבָר דּוֹמֶה  לְגַבְרָא דְּטַרְקֵיהּ לְגַלֵּיהּ וְאַבְּדֵיהּ לְמַפְתְּחֵיהּ
human_translation: A certain Galilean taught before Rav Ḥisda: a parable of Elijah; to what is this matter comparable? to a man who slammed his door and lost his key.
llm_translation: The one from Galilee expounded before Rav Ḥisda: A parable that Elijah said: What is the matter comparable to? To a man who was walking on his way, and lost his keys.

hebrew_text: דָּרֵשׁ רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּצִיפּוֹרִי אַבָּא אֵלִיָּהוּ
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei of Tzippori taught: Father Elijah,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei of Tsippori sought out Elijah.

hebrew_text: קַפְּדָן הֲוָה רְגִיל לְמֵיתֵי גַּבֵּיהּ אִיכַּסִּי מִינֵּיהּ תְּלָתָא יוֹמֵי וְלָא אֲתָא כִּי אֲתָא אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַמַּאי לָא אֲתָא מָר אֲמַר לֵיהּ קַפְּדָן קָרֵית לִי אֲמַר לֵיהּ הָא דְּקַמַּן דְּקָא קָפֵיד מָר
human_translation: difficult. was accustomed to coming before He was obscured from him for three days and did not come. When he came said to him: Why did the Master not come? said to him: you called me difficult. said to This that is before us as my Master was difficult
llm_translation: Kapdan used to regularly bring his camels to drink from his well for three days, but did not come. When he did come, he said to him, "Why did you not come, sir?" He said to him, "Kapdan, have you read what the Master has said ahead of us?"

hebrew_text: 'וְלֹא יִדְבַּק בְּיָדְךָ מְאוּמָה מִן הַחֵרֶם' כׇּל זְמַן שֶׁרְשָׁעִים בָּעוֹלָם חֲרוֹן אַף בָּעוֹלָם וְכוּ' מַאן רְשָׁעִים אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף גַּנָּבֵי
human_translation: “And there shall cleave nothing of that which was devoted to your hand” as long as the wicked in the world, wrath in the world. Who are wicked Rav Yosef said: thieves.
llm_translation: "And not shall adhere in your hand anything from the ban. As long as the wicked are in the world, anger is in the world, etc." Who are the wicked? Rav Yosef said, "Thieves."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן רָשָׁע בָּא לָעוֹלָם  חָרוֹן בָּא לְעוֹלָם שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר 'בְּבוֹא רָשָׁע בָּא גַם בּוּז וְעִם קָלוֹן חֶרְפָּה' רָשָׁע אָבֵד מִן הָעוֹלָם  טוֹבָה בָּאָה לְעוֹלָם שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר 'וּבַאֲבֹד רְשָׁעִים רִנָּה' צַדִּיק נִפְטָר מִן הָעוֹלָם  רָעָה בָּאָה לְעוֹלָם שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר 'הַצַּדִּיק אָבָד וְאֵין אִישׁ שָׂם עַל לֵב וְאַנְשֵׁי חֶסֶד נֶאֱסָפִים בְּאֵין מֵבִין כִּי מִפְּנֵי הָרָעָה נֶאֱסַף הַצַּדִּיק' צַדִּיק בָּא לָעוֹלָם  טוֹבָה בָּאָה לְעוֹלָם שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר 'זֶה יְנַחֲמֵנוּ מִמַּעֲשֵׂנוּ וּמֵעִצְּבוֹן יָדֵינוּ'
human_translation: The Sages taught a wicked comes into the world, wrath comes into the world, as it is stated: “When the wicked comes into the world, contempt also comes, and with ignominy, reproach” a wicked is eliminated from the world, good comes into the world, as it is stated: “And when the wicked perish there is jubilation” a righteous passes from the world, evil comes into the world, as it is stated: “The righteous perishes and no man lays it to heart; and merciful men are taken, none understand that due to the evil the righteous is taken” a righteous comes into the world, good comes into the world as it is stated “This is one who shall comfort us for our work and the toil of our hands”
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: The wicked come to the world, anger comes to the world, as it is said, "When the wicked comes, contempt also comes, and with dishonor comes reproach." The wicked perish from the world, goodness comes to the world, as it is said, "And at the destruction of the wicked, there is jubilation." The righteous depart from the world, evil comes to the world, as it is said, "The righteous perishes, and no man lays it to heart, and men of kindness are gathered, with none considering that because of evil the righteous is gathered." The righteous come to the world, goodness comes to the world, as it is said, "This will comfort us amid our deeds and the toil of our hands."

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ
llm_translation: We will return to you.
